Translation: 4 Mitra and Varuṇa, renowned as Gods of consecrated might,

Sanskit Text: जज्ञाना पूतदक्षसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jajñānā pūtadakṣasā ||
Translation: We call to drink the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: रतेन याव रताव्र्धाव रतस्य जयोतिषस पती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtena yāv ṛtāvṛdhāv ṛtasya jyotiṣas patī |
Translation: 5 Those who by Law uphold the Law, Lords of the shining light of Law,

Sanskit Text: ता मित्रावरुणा हुवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā mitrāvaruṇā huve ||
Translation: Mitra I call, and Varuṇa.

Sanskit Text: वरुणः पराविता भुवन मित्रो विश्वाभिरूतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: varuṇaḥ prāvitā bhuvan mitro viśvābhirūtibhiḥ |
Translation: 6 Let Varuṇa be our chief defence, let Mitra guard us with all aids

Sanskit Text: करतां नः सुराधसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: karatāṃ naḥ surādhasaḥ ||
Translation: Both make us rich exceedingly.

Sanskit Text: मरुत्वन्तं हवामह इन्द्रमा सोमपीतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: marutvantaṃ havāmaha indramā somapītaye |
Translation: 7 Indra, by Maruts girt, we call to drink the Soma juice: may he

Sanskit Text: सजूर्गणेन तरिम्पतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajūrghaṇena trimpatu ||
Translation: Sate him in union with his troop.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रज्येष्ठा मरुद्गणा देवासः पूषरातयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrajyeṣṭhā marudghaṇā devāsaḥ pūṣarātayaḥ |
Translation: 8 Gods, Marut hosts whom Indra leads, distributers of Pūṣan's gifts,

Sanskit Text: विश्वे मम शरुता हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve mama śrutā havam ||
Translation: Hearken ye all unto my cry.

Sanskit Text: हत वर्त्रं सुदानव इन्द्रेण सहसा युजा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hata vṛtraṃ sudānava indreṇa sahasā yujā |
Translation: 9 With conquering Indra for ally, strike Vṛtra down, ye bounteous Gods

Sanskit Text: मा नो दुःशंस ईशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no duḥśaṃsa īśata ||
Translation: Let not the wicked master us.

Sanskit Text: विश्वान देवान हवामहे मरुतः सोमपीतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvān devān havāmahe marutaḥ somapītaye |
Translation: 10 We call the Universal Gods, and Maruts to the Soma draught,

Sanskit Text: उग्रा हि पर्श्निमातरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughrā hi pṛśnimātaraḥ ||
Translation: For passing strong are Pṛśni's Sons.

Sanskit Text: जयतामिव तन्यतुर्मरुतामेति धर्ष्णुया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jayatāmiva tanyaturmarutāmeti dhṛṣṇuyā |
Translation: 11 Fierce comes the Maruts’ thundering voice, like that of conquerors, when ye go

Sanskit Text: यच्छुभं याथना नरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yacchubhaṃ yāthanā naraḥ ||
Translation: Forward to victory, O Men.

Sanskit Text: हस्काराद विद्युतस पर्यतो जाता अवन्तु नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: haskārād vidyutas paryato jātā avantu naḥ |
Translation: 12 Born of the laughing lightning. may the Maruts guard us everywhere

Sanskit Text: मरुतो मर्ळयन्तु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maruto mṛḷayantu naḥ ||
Translation: May they be gracious unto Us.

Sanskit Text: आ पूषञ्चित्रबर्हिषमाघ्र्णे धरुणं दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā pūṣañcitrabarhiṣamāghṛṇe dharuṇaṃ divaḥ |
Translation: 13 Like some lost animal, drive to us, bright Pūṣan, him who bears up heaven,

Sanskit Text: आजा नष्टं यथा पशुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ājā naṣṭaṃ yathā paśum ||
Translation: Resting on many-coloured grass.

Sanskit Text: पूषा राजानमाघ्र्णिरपगूळ्हं गुहा हितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūṣā rājānamāghṛṇirapaghūḷhaṃ ghuhā hitam |
Translation: 14 Pūṣan the Bright has found the King, concealed and hidden in a cave,

Sanskit Text: अविन्दच्चित्रबर्हिषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avindaccitrabarhiṣam ||
Translation: Who rests on grass of many hues.

Sanskit Text: उतो स मह्यमिन्दुभिः षड युक्ताननुसेषिधत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto sa mahyamindubhiḥ ṣaḍ yuktānanuseṣidhat |
Translation: 15 And may he. duly bring to me the six bound closely, through these drops,

Sanskit Text: गोभिर्यवं न चर्क्र्षत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghobhiryavaṃ na carkṛṣat ||
Translation: As one who ploughs with steers brings corn.

Sanskit Text: अम्बयो यन्त्यध्वभिर्जामयो अध्वरीयताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ambayo yantyadhvabhirjāmayo adhvarīyatām |
Translation: 16 Along their paths the Mothers go, Sisters of priestly ministrants,

Sanskit Text: पर्ञ्चतीर्मधुना पयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛñcatīrmadhunā payaḥ ||
Translation: Mingling their sweetness with the milk.

Sanskit Text: अमूर्या उप सूर्ये याभिर्वा सूर्यः सह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: amūryā upa sūrye yābhirvā sūryaḥ saha |
Translation: 17 May Waters gathered near the Sun, and those wherewith the Sun is joined,

Sanskit Text: ता नो हिन्वन्त्वध्वरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā no hinvantvadhvaram ||
Translation: Speed forth this sacrifice of ours.

Sanskit Text: अपो देवीरुप हवये यत्र गावः पिबन्ति नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apo devīrupa hvaye yatra ghāvaḥ pibanti naḥ |
Translation: 18 I call the Waters, Goddesses, wherein our cattle quench their thirst;

Sanskit Text: सिन्दुभ्यः कर्त्वं हविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sindubhyaḥ kartvaṃ haviḥ ||
Translation: Oblations to the Streams be given.

Sanskit Text: अप्स्वन्तरम्र्तमप्सु भेषजमपामुत परशस्तये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apsvantaramṛtamapsu bheṣajamapāmuta praśastaye |
Translation: 19 Amrit is in the Waters in the Waters there is healing balm

Sanskit Text: देवाभवत वाजिनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devābhavata vājinaḥ ||
Translation: Be swift, ye Gods, to give them praise.

Sanskit Text: अप्सु मे सोमो अब्रवीदन्तर्विश्वानि भेषजा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apsu me somo abravīdantarviśvāni bheṣajā |
Translation: 20 Within the Waters—Soma thus hath told me—dwell all balms that heal,

Sanskit Text: अग्निं च विश्वशम्भुवमापश्च विश्वभेषजीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ ca viśvaśambhuvamāpaśca viśvabheṣajīḥ ||
Translation: And Agni, he who blesseth all. The Waters hold all medicines.

Sanskit Text: आपः पर्णीत भेषजं वरूथं तन्वे मम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpaḥ pṛṇīta bheṣajaṃ varūthaṃ tanve mama |
Translation: 21 O Waters, teem with medicine to keep my body safe from harm,

Sanskit Text: जयोक च सूर्यं दर्शे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyok ca sūryaṃ dṛśe ||
Translation: So that I long may see the Sun.

Sanskit Text: इदमापः पर वहत यत किं च दुरितं मयि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idamāpaḥ pra vahata yat kiṃ ca duritaṃ mayi |
Translation: 22 Whatever sin is found in me, whatever evil I have wrought.

Sanskit Text: यद वाहमभिदुद्रोह यद वा शेप उतान्र्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vāhamabhidudroha yad vā śepa utānṛtam ||
Translation: If I have lied or falsely sworn, Waters, remove it far from me.

Sanskit Text: आपो अद्यान्वचारिषं रसेन समगस्महि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpo adyānvacāriṣaṃ rasena samaghasmahi |
Translation: 23 The Waters I this day have sought, and to their moisture have we come:

Sanskit Text: पयस्वानग्न आगहि तं मा सं सर्ज वर्चसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: payasvānaghna āghahi taṃ mā saṃ sṛja varcasā ||
Translation: O Agni, rich in milk, come thou, and with thy splendour cover me.

Sanskit Text: सं माग्ने वर्चसा सर्ज सं परजया समायुषा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ māghne varcasā sṛja saṃ prajayā samāyuṣā |
Translation: 24 Fill me with splendour, Agni; give offspring and length of days; the Gods

Sanskit Text: विद्युर्मेस्य देवा इन्द्रो विद्यात सह रषिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidyurmeasya devā indro vidyāt saha ṛṣibhiḥ ||
Translation: Shall know me even as I am, and Indra with the Ṛṣis, know.

Sanskit Text: कस्य नूनं कतमस्याम्र्तानां मनामहे चारु देवस्य नाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kasya nūnaṃ katamasyāmṛtānāṃ manāmahe cāru devasya nāma |
Translation: 1 WHO now is he, what God among Immortals, of whose auspicious name we may bethink us?

Sanskit Text: को नो मह्या अदितये पुनर्दात पितरं च दर्शेयं मातरं च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko no mahyā aditaye punardāt pitaraṃ ca dṛśeyaṃ mātaraṃ ca ||
Translation: Who shall to mighty Aditi restore us, that I may see my Father and my Mother?

Sanskit Text: अग्नेर्वयं परथमस्याम्र्तानां मनामहे चारु देवस्य नाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnervayaṃ prathamasyāmṛtānāṃ manāmahe cāru devasya nāma |
Translation: 2 Agni the God the first among the Immortals,—of his auspicious name let us bethink us.

Sanskit Text: स नो मह्या अदितये पुनर्दात पितरं च दर्शेयं मातरं च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no mahyā aditaye punardāt pitaraṃ ca dṛśeyaṃ mātaraṃ ca ||
Translation: He shall to mighty Aditi restore us, that I may see my Father and my Mother.

Sanskit Text: अभि तवा देव सवितरीशानं वार्याणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tvā deva savitarīśānaṃ vāryāṇām |
Translation: 3 To thee, O Savitar, the Lord of precious things, who helpest us

Sanskit Text: सदावन भागमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadāvan bhāghamīmahe ||
Translation: Continually, for our share we come—

Sanskit Text: यश्चिद धि त इत्था भगः शशमानः पुरा निदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaścid dhi ta itthā bhaghaḥ śaśamānaḥ purā nidaḥ |
Translation: 4 Wealth, highly lauded ere reproach hath fallen on it, which is laid,

Sanskit Text: अद्वेषो हस्तयोर्दधे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adveṣo hastayordadhe ||
Translation: Free from all hatred, in thy hands

Sanskit Text: भगभक्तस्य ते वयमुदशेम तवावसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhaghabhaktasya te vayamudaśema tavāvasā |
Translation: 5 Through thy protection may we come to even the height of affluence

Sanskit Text: मूर्धानं राय आरभे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mūrdhānaṃ rāya ārabhe ||
Translation: Which Bhaga hath dealt out to us.

Sanskit Text: नहि ते कषत्रं न सहो न मन्युं वयश्चनामी पतयन्त आपुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi te kṣatraṃ na saho na manyuṃ vayaścanāmī patayanta āpuḥ |
Translation: 6 Ne’er have those birds that fly through air attained to thy high dominion or thy might or spirit;

Sanskit Text: नेमा आपो अनिमिषं चरन्तीर्न ये वातस्य परमिनन्त्यभ्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nemā āpo animiṣaṃ carantīrna ye vātasya praminantyabhvam ||
Translation: Nor these the waters that flow on for ever, nor hills, abaters of the wind's wild fury.

Sanskit Text: अबुध्ने राजा वरुणो वनस्योर्ध्वं सतूपं ददते पूतदक्षः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abudhne rājā varuṇo vanasyordhvaṃ stūpaṃ dadate pūtadakṣaḥ |
Translation: 7 Varuṇa, King, of hallowed might, sustaineth erect the Tree's stem in the baseless region.

Sanskit Text: नीचीना सथुरुपरि बुध्न एषामस्मे अन्तर्निहिताःकेतवः सयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nīcīnā sthurupari budhna eṣāmasme antarnihitāḥketavaḥ syuḥ ||
Translation: Its rays, whose root is high above, stream downward. Deep may they sink within us, and be hidden.

Sanskit Text: उरुं हि राजा वरुणश्चकार सूर्याय पन्थामन्वेतवा उ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uruṃ hi rājā varuṇaścakāra sūryāya panthāmanvetavā u |
Translation: 8 King Varuṇa hath made a spacious pathway, a pathway for the Sun wherein to travel.

Sanskit Text: अपदे पादा परतिधातवे.अकरुतापवक्ता हर्दयाविधश्चित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apade pādā pratidhātave.akarutāpavaktā hṛdayāvidhaścit ||
Translation: Where no way was he made him set his footstep, and warned afar whate’er afflicts the spirit.

Sanskit Text: शतं ते राजन भिषजः सहस्रमुर्वी गभीरा सुमतिष टे अस्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ te rājan bhiṣajaḥ sahasramurvī ghabhīrā sumatiṣ ṭe astu |
Translation: 9 A hundred balms are thine, O King, a thousand; deep and wide-reaching also be thy favours.

Sanskit Text: बाधस्व दूरे निरतिं पराचैः कर्तं चिदेनः पर मुमुग्ध्यस्मत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bādhasva dūre nirtiṃ parācaiḥ kṛtaṃ cidenaḥ pra mumughdhyasmat ||
Translation: Far from us, far away drive thou Destruction. Put from us e’en the sin we have committed.

Sanskit Text: अमी य रक्षा निहितास उच्चा नक्तं दद्र्श्रे कुह चिद दिवेयुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: amī ya ṛkṣā nihitāsa uccā naktaṃ dadṛśre kuha cid diveyuḥ |
Translation: 10 Whither by day depart the constellations that shine at night, set high in heaven above us?

Sanskit Text: अदब्धानि वरुणस्य वरतानि विचाकशच्चन्द्रमा नक्तमेति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adabdhāni varuṇasya vratāni vicākaśaccandramā naktameti ||
Translation: Varuṇa's holy laws remain unweakened, and through the night the Moon moves on in splendor

Sanskit Text: तत तवा यामि बरह्मणा वन्दमानस्तदा शास्ते यजमानो हविर्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat tvā yāmi brahmaṇā vandamānastadā śāste yajamāno havirbhiḥ |
Translation: 11 I ask this of thee with my prayer adoring; thy worshipper craves this with his oblation.

Sanskit Text: अहेळमानो वरुणेह बोध्युरुशंस मा न आयुःप्र मोषीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aheḷamāno varuṇeha bodhyuruśaṃsa mā na āyuḥpra moṣīḥ ||
Translation: Varuṇa, stay thou here and be not angry; steal not our life from us, O thou Wide-Ruler.

Sanskit Text: तदिन नक्तं तद दिवा मह्यमाहुस्तदयं केतो हर्द आ वि चष्टे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadin naktaṃ tad divā mahyamāhustadayaṃ keto hṛda ā vi caṣṭe |
Translation: 12 Nightly and daily this one thing they tell me, this too the thought of mine own heart repeateth.

Sanskit Text: शुनःशेपो यमह्वद गर्भीतः सो अस्मान राजा वरुणो मुमोक्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śunaḥśepo yamahvad ghṛbhītaḥ so asmān rājā varuṇo mumoktu ||
Translation: May he to whom prayed fettered Śunaḥśepa, may he the Sovran Varuṇa release us.

Sanskit Text: शुनःशेपो हयह्वद गर्भीतस्त्रिष्वादित्यं दरुपदेषु बद्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śunaḥśepo hyahvad ghṛbhītastriṣvādityaṃ drupadeṣu baddhaḥ |
Translation: 13 Bound to three pillars captured Śunaḥśepa thus to the Āditya made his supplication.

Sanskit Text: अवैनं राजा वरुणः सस्र्ज्याद विद्वानदब्धो वि मुमोक्तु पाशान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avainaṃ rājā varuṇaḥ sasṛjyād vidvānadabdho vi mumoktu pāśān ||
Translation: Him may the Sovran Varuṇa deliver, wise, ne’er deceived, loosen the bonds that bind him.

Sanskit Text: अव ते हेळो वरुण नमोभिरव यज्ञेभिरीमहे हविर्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava te heḷo varuṇa namobhirava yajñebhirīmahe havirbhiḥ |
Translation: 14 With bending down, oblations, sacrifices, O Varuṇa, we deprecate thine anger:

Sanskit Text: कषयन्नस्मभ्यमसुर परचेता राजन्नेनांसि शिश्रथः कर्तानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣayannasmabhyamasura pracetā rājannenāṃsi śiśrathaḥ kṛtāni ||
Translation: Wise Asura, thou King of wide dominion, loosen the bonds of sins by us committed.

Sanskit Text: उदुत्तमं वरुण पाशमस्मदवाधमं वि मध्यमं शरथाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uduttamaṃ varuṇa pāśamasmadavādhamaṃ vi madhyamaṃ śrathāya |
Translation: 15 Loosen the bonds, O Varuṇa, that hold me, loosen the bonds above, between, and under.

Sanskit Text: अथा वयमादित्य वरते तवानागसो अदितये सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā vayamāditya vrate tavānāghaso aditaye syāma ||
Translation: So in thy holy law may we made sinless belong to Aditi, O thou Āditya.

Sanskit Text: यच्चिद धि ते विशो यथा पर देव वरुण वरतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaccid dhi te viśo yathā pra deva varuṇa vratam |
Translation: 1 WHATEVER law of thine, O God, O Varuṇa, as we are men,

Sanskit Text: मिनीमसिद्यवि-दयवि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: minīmasidyavi-dyavi ||
Translation: Day after day we violate.

Sanskit Text: मा नो वधाय हत्नवे जिहीळानस्य रीरधः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no vadhāya hatnave jihīḷānasya rīradhaḥ |
Translation: 2 give us not as a prey to death, to be destroyed by thee in wrath,

Sanskit Text: मा हर्णानस्य मन्यवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā hṛṇānasya manyave ||
Translation: To thy fierce anger when displeased.

Sanskit Text: वि मर्ळीकाय ते मनो रथीरश्वं न सन्दितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi mṛḷīkāya te mano rathīraśvaṃ na sanditam |
Translation: 3 To gain thy mercy, Varuṇa, with hymns we bind thy heart, as binds

Sanskit Text: गीर्भिर्वरुण सीमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghīrbhirvaruṇa sīmahi ||
Translation: The charioteer his tethered horse.

Sanskit Text: परा हि मे विमन्यवः पतन्ति वस्यैष्टये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parā hi me vimanyavaḥ patanti vasyaiṣṭaye |
Translation: 4 They flee from me dispirited, bent only on obtaining wealth,

Sanskit Text: वयो न वसतीरुप ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayo na vasatīrupa ||
Translation: As to their nests the birds of air.

Sanskit Text: कदा कषत्रश्रियं नरमा वरुणं करामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadā kṣatraśriyaṃ naramā varuṇaṃ karāmahe |
Translation: 5 When shall we bring, to be appeased, the Hero, Lord of warrior might,

Sanskit Text: मर्ळीकायोरुचक्षसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mṛḷīkāyorucakṣasam ||
Translation: Him, the far-seeing Varuṇa?

Sanskit Text: तदित समानमाशाते वेनन्ता न पर युछतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadit samānamāśāte venantā na pra yuchataḥ |
Translation: 6 This, this with joy they both accept in common: never do they fail

Sanskit Text: धर्तव्रताय दाशुषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhṛtavratāya dāśuṣe ||
Translation: The ever-faithful worshipper.

Sanskit Text: वेदा यो वीनां पदमन्तरिक्षेण पतताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vedā yo vīnāṃ padamantarikṣeṇa patatām |
Translation: 7 He knows the path of birds that fly through heaven, and, Sovran of the sea,

Sanskit Text: वेद नावः समुद्रियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: veda nāvaḥ samudriyaḥ ||
Translation: He knows the ships that are thereon.

Sanskit Text: वेद मासो धर्तव्रतो दवादश परजावतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: veda māso dhṛtavrato dvādaśa prajāvataḥ |
Translation: 8 True to his holy law, he knows the twelve moons with their progeny:

Sanskit Text: वेदा य उपजायते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vedā ya upajāyate ||
Translation: He knows the moon of later birth.

Sanskit Text: वेद वातस्य वर्तनिमुरोर्र्ष्वस्य बर्हतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: veda vātasya vartanimurorṛṣvasya bṛhataḥ |
Translation: 9 He knows the pathway of the wind, the spreading, high, and mighty wind:

Sanskit Text: वेदा ये अध्यासते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vedā ye adhyāsate ||
Translation: He knows the Gods who dwell above.

Sanskit Text: नि षसाद धर्तव्रतो वरुणः पस्त्यास्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni ṣasāda dhṛtavrato varuṇaḥ pastyāsvā |
Translation: 10 Varuṇa, true to holy law, sits down among his people; he,

Sanskit Text: साम्राज्याय सुक्रतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sāmrājyāya sukratuḥ ||
Translation: Most wise, sits there to govern all.

Sanskit Text: अतो विश्वान्यद्भुता चिकित्वानभि पश्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ato viśvānyadbhutā cikitvānabhi paśyati |
Translation: 11 From thence

Sanskit Text: <a href="errata.htm#1">
perceiving
he beholds all wondrous things, both what hath been,
कर्तानि या चकर्त्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛtāni yā cakartvā ||
Translation: And what hereafter will be done.

Sanskit Text: स नो विश्वाहा सुक्रतुरादित्यः सुपथा करत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no viśvāhā sukraturādityaḥ supathā karat |
Translation: 12 May that Āditya, very wise, make fair paths for us all our days:

Sanskit Text: पर ण आयूंषि तारिषत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tāriṣat ||
Translation: May he prolong our lives for us.

Sanskit Text: बिभ्रद दरापिं हिरण्ययं वरुणो वस्त निर्णिजम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bibhrad drāpiṃ hiraṇyayaṃ varuṇo vasta nirṇijam |
Translation: 13 Varuṇa, wearing golden mail, hath clad him in a shining robe.

Sanskit Text: परि सपशो नि षेदिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari spaśo ni ṣedire ||
Translation: His spies are seated found about.

Sanskit Text: न यं दिप्सन्ति दिप्सवो न दरुह्वाणो जनानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yaṃ dipsanti dipsavo na druhvāṇo janānām |
Translation: 14 The God whom enemies threaten not, nor those who tyrannize o’er men,

Sanskit Text: न देवमभिमातयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na devamabhimātayaḥ ||
Translation: Nor those whose minds are bent on wrong.

Sanskit Text: उत यो मानुषेष्वा यशश्चक्रे असाम्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta yo mānuṣeṣvā yaśaścakre asāmyā |
Translation: 15 He who gives glory to mankind, not glory that is incomplete,

Sanskit Text: अस्माकमुदरेष्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākamudareṣvā ||
Translation: To our own bodies giving it.

Sanskit Text: परा मे यन्ति धीतयो गावो न गव्यूतीरनु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parā me yanti dhītayo ghāvo na ghavyūtīranu |
Translation: 16 Yearning for the wide-seeing One, my thoughts move onward unto him,

Sanskit Text: इछन्तीरुरुचक्षसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ichantīrurucakṣasam ||
Translation: As kine unto their pastures move.

Sanskit Text: सं नु वोचावहै पुनर्यतो मे मध्वाभ्र्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ nu vocāvahai punaryato me madhvābhṛtam |
Translation: 17 Once more together let us speak, because my meath is brought: priest-like

Sanskit Text: होतेव कषदसे परियम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hoteva kṣadase priyam ||
Translation: Thou eatest what is dear to thee.

Sanskit Text: दर्शं नु विश्वदर्षतं दर्शं रथमधि कषमि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: darśaṃ nu viśvadarṣataṃ darśaṃ rathamadhi kṣami |
Translation: 18 Now saw I him whom all may see, I saw his car above the earth:

Sanskit Text: एता जुषत मे गिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: etā juṣata me ghiraḥ ||
Translation: He hath accepted these my songs.

Sanskit Text: इमं मे वरुण शरुधी हवमद्या च मर्ळय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ me varuṇa śrudhī havamadyā ca mṛḷaya |
Translation: 19 Varuṇa, hear this call of mine: be gracious unto us this day

Sanskit Text: तवामवस्युरा चके ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmavasyurā cake ||
Translation: Longing for help I cried to thee.

Sanskit Text: तवं विश्वस्य मेधिर दिवश्च गमश्च राजसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ viśvasya medhira divaśca ghmaśca rājasi |
Translation: 20 Thou, O wise God, art Lord of all, thou art the King of earth and heaven

Sanskit Text: स यामनिप्रति शरुधि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa yāmaniprati śrudhi ||
Translation: Hear, as thou goest on thy way.

Sanskit Text: उदुत्तमं मुमुग्धि नो वि पाशं मध्यमं चर्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uduttamaṃ mumughdhi no vi pāśaṃ madhyamaṃ cṛta |
Translation: 21 Release us from the upper bond, untie the bond between, and loose

Sanskit Text: अवाधमानि जीवसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avādhamāni jīvase ||
Translation: The bonds below, that I may live.

Sanskit Text: वसिष्वा हि मियेध्य वस्त्राण्यूर्जां पते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasiṣvā hi miyedhya vastrāṇyūrjāṃ pate |
Translation: 1 O WORTHY of oblation, Lord of prospering powers, assume thy robes,

Sanskit Text: सेमं नो अध्वरं यज ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: semaṃ no adhvaraṃ yaja ||
Translation: And offer this our sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: नि नो होता वरेण्यः सदा यविष्ठ मन्मभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni no hotā vareṇyaḥ sadā yaviṣṭha manmabhiḥ |
Translation: 2 Sit ever to be chosen, as our Priest, most youthful, through our hymns,

Sanskit Text: अग्ने दिवित्मता वचः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne divitmatā vacaḥ ||
Translation: O Agni, through our heavenly word.

Sanskit Text: आ नि षमा सूनवे पितापिर्यजत्यापये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ni ṣmā sūnave pitāpiryajatyāpaye |
Translation: 3 For here a Father for his son, Kinsman for kinsman worshippeth,

Sanskit Text: सखा सख्ये वरेण्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhā sakhye vareṇyaḥ ||
Translation: And Friend, choice-worthy, for his friend.

Sanskit Text: आ नो बर्ही रिशादसो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no barhī riśādaso varuṇo mitro aryamā |
Translation: 4 Here let the foe-destroyers sit, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman,

Sanskit Text: सीदन्तु मनुषो यथा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sīdantu manuṣo yathā ||
Translation: Like men, upon our sacred grass.

Sanskit Text: पूर्व्य होतरस्य नो मन्दस्व सख्यस्य च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvya hotarasya no mandasva sakhyasya ca |
Translation: 5 O ancient Herald, be thou glad in this our rite and fellowship:

Sanskit Text: इमा उ षु शरुधी गिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā u ṣu śrudhī ghiraḥ ||
Translation: Hearken thou well to these our songs.

Sanskit Text: यच्चिद धि शश्वता तना देवं-देवं यजामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaccid dhi śaśvatā tanā devaṃ-devaṃ yajāmahe |
Translation: 6 Whate’er in this perpetual course we sacrifice to God and God,

Sanskit Text: तवे इद्धूयते हविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve iddhūyate haviḥ ||
Translation: That gift is offered up in thee

Sanskit Text: परियो नो अस्तु विश्पतिर्होता मन्द्रो वरेण्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyo no astu viśpatirhotā mandro vareṇyaḥ |
Translation: 7 May he be our dear household Lord, Priest, pleasant and, choice-worthy may

Sanskit Text: परियाः सवग्नयो वयम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyāḥ svaghnayo vayam ||
Translation: We, with bright fires, be dear to him.

Sanskit Text: सवग्नयो हि वार्यं देवासो दधिरे च नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svaghnayo hi vāryaṃ devāso dadhire ca naḥ |
Translation: 8 The Gods, adored with brilliant fires. have granted precious wealth to us

Sanskit Text: सवग्नयो मनामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svaghnayo manāmahe ||
Translation: So, with bright fires, we pray to thee.

Sanskit Text: अथा न उभयेषामम्र्त मर्त्यानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā na ubhayeṣāmamṛta martyānām |
Translation: 9 And, O Immortal One, so may the eulogies of mortal men

Sanskit Text: मिथः सन्तु परशस्तयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mithaḥ santu praśastayaḥ ||
Translation: Belong to us and thee alike.

Sanskit Text: विश्वेभिरग्ने अग्निभिरिमं यज्ञमिदं वचः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvebhiraghne aghnibhirimaṃ yajñamidaṃ vacaḥ |
Translation: 10 With all thy fires, O Agni, find pleasure in this our sacrifice,

Sanskit Text: चनो धाः सहसो यहो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cano dhāḥ sahaso yaho ||
Translation: And this our speech, O Son of Strength.

Sanskit Text: अश्वं न तवा वारवन्तं वन्दध्या अग्निं नमोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvaṃ na tvā vāravantaṃ vandadhyā aghniṃ namobhiḥ |
Translation: 1 WITH worship will I glorify thee, Agni, like a long-tailed steed,

Sanskit Text: सम्राजन्तमध्वराणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samrājantamadhvarāṇām ||
Translation: Imperial Lord of sacred rites.

Sanskit Text: स घा नः सूनुः शवसा पर्थुप्रगामा सुशेवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ghā naḥ sūnuḥ śavasā pṛthupraghāmā suśevaḥ |
Translation: 2 May the far-striding Son of Strength, bringer of great felicity,

Sanskit Text: मीढ्वानस्माकं बभूयात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mīḍhvānasmākaṃ babhūyāt ||
Translation: Who pours his gifts like rain, be ours.

Sanskit Text: स नो दूराच्चासाच्च नि मर्त्यादघायोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no dūrāccāsācca ni martyādaghāyoḥ |
Translation: 3 Lord of all life, from near; from far, do thou, O Agni evermore

Sanskit Text: पाहि सदमिद विश्वायुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāhi sadamid viśvāyuḥ ||
Translation: Protect us from the sinful man.

Sanskit Text: इममू षु तवमस्माकं सनिं गायत्रं नव्यांसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imamū ṣu tvamasmākaṃ saniṃ ghāyatraṃ navyāṃsam |
Translation: 4 O Agni, graciously announce this our oblation to the Gods,

Sanskit Text: अग्ने देवेषु पर वोचः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne deveṣu pra vocaḥ ||
Translation: And this our newest song of praise.

Sanskit Text: आ नो भज परमेष्वा वाजेषु मध्यमेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no bhaja parameṣvā vājeṣu madhyameṣu |
Translation: 5 Give us a share of strength most high, a share of strength that is below,

Sanskit Text: शिक्षा वस्वोन्तमस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śikṣā vasvoantamasya ||
Translation: A share of strength that is between.

Sanskit Text: विभक्तासि चित्रभानो सिन्धोरूर्मा उपाक आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vibhaktāsi citrabhāno sindhorūrmā upāka ā |
Translation: 6 Thou dealest gifts, resplendent One; nigh, as with waves of Sindhu, thou

Sanskit Text: सद्यो दाशुषे कषरसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadyo dāśuṣe kṣarasi ||
Translation: Swift streamest to the worshipper.

Sanskit Text: यमग्ने पर्त्सु मर्त्यमवा वाजेषु यं जुनाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamaghne pṛtsu martyamavā vājeṣu yaṃ junāḥ |
Translation: 7 That man is lord of endless strength whom thou protectest in the fight,

Sanskit Text: स यन्ताशश्वतीरिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa yantāśaśvatīriṣaḥ ||
Translation: Agni, or urgest to the fray.

Sanskit Text: नकिरस्य सहन्त्य पर्येता कयस्य चित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nakirasya sahantya paryetā kayasya cit |
Translation: 8 Him, whosoever he may be, no man may vanquish, mighty One:

Sanskit Text: वाजो अस्ति शरवाय्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājo asti śravāyyaḥ ||
Translation: Nay, very glorious power is his.

Sanskit Text: स वाजं विश्वचर्षणिरर्वद्भिरस्तु तरुता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vājaṃ viśvacarṣaṇirarvadbhirastu tarutā |
Translation: 9 May he who dwells with all mankind bear us with war-steeds through the fight,

Sanskit Text: विप्रेभिरस्तु सनिता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viprebhirastu sanitā ||
Translation: And with the singers win the spoil.

Sanskit Text: जराबोध तद विविड्ढि विशे-विशे यज्ञियाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jarābodha tad viviḍḍhi viśe-viśe yajñiyāya |
Translation: 10 Help, thou who knowest lauds, this work, this eulogy to Rudra, him

Sanskit Text: सतोमं रुद्राय दर्शीकम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stomaṃ rudrāya dṛśīkam ||
Translation: Adorable in every house.

Sanskit Text: स नो महाननिमानो धूमकेतुः पुरुश्चन्द्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no mahānanimāno dhūmaketuḥ puruścandraḥ |
Translation: 11 May this our God, great, limitless, smoke-bannered excellently bright,

Sanskit Text: धिये वाजाय हिन्वतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiye vājāya hinvatu ||
Translation: Urge us to strength and holy thought.

Sanskit Text: स रेवानिव विश्पतिर्दैव्यः केतुः शर्णोतु नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa revāniva viśpatirdaivyaḥ ketuḥ śṛṇotu naḥ |
Translation: 12 Like some rich Lord of men may he, Agni the banner of the Gods,

Sanskit Text: उक्थैरग्निर्ब्र्हद्भानुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukthairaghnirbṛhadbhānuḥ ||
Translation: Refulgent, hear us through our lauds.

Sanskit Text: नमो महद्भ्यो नमो अर्भकेभ्यो नमो युवभ्यो नम आशिनेभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: namo mahadbhyo namo arbhakebhyo namo yuvabhyo nama āśinebhyaḥ |
Translation: 13 Glory to Gods, the mighty and the lesser glory to Gods the younger and the elder!

Sanskit Text: यजाम देवान यदि शक्नवाम मा जयायसः शंसमा वर्क्षि देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajāma devān yadi śaknavāma mā jyāyasaḥ śaṃsamā vṛkṣi devāḥ ||
Translation: Let us, if we have power, pay the God worship: no better prayer than this, ye Gods, acknowledge.

Sanskit Text: यत्र गरावा पर्थुबुध्न ऊर्ध्वो भवति सोतवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatra ghrāvā pṛthubudhna ūrdhvo bhavati sotave |
Translation: 1 THERE where the broad-based stone raised on high to press the juices out,

Sanskit Text: उलूखलसुतानामवेद विन्द्र जल्गुलः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ulūkhalasutānāmaved vindra jalghulaḥ ||
Translation: O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.

Sanskit Text: यत्र दवाविव जघनाधिषवण्या कर्ता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatra dvāviva jaghanādhiṣavaṇyā kṛtā |
Translation: 2 Where, like broad hips, to hold the juice the platters of the press are laid,
O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.

Sanskit Text: यत्र नार्यपच्यवमुपच्यवं च शिक्षते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatra nāryapacyavamupacyavaṃ ca śikṣate |
Translation: 3 There where the woman marks and leans the pestle's constant rise and fall,
O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.

Sanskit Text: यत्र मन्थां विबध्नते रश्मीन यमितवा इव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatra manthāṃ vibadhnate raśmīn yamitavā iva |
Translation: 4 Where, as with reins to guide a horse, they bind the churning-staff with cords,
O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.

Sanskit Text: यच्चिद धि तवं गर्हेग्र्ह उलूखलक युज्यसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaccid dhi tvaṃ ghṛheghṛha ulūkhalaka yujyase |
Translation: 5 If of a truth in every house, O Mortar thou art set for work,

Sanskit Text: इह दयुमत्तमं वद यजतामिव दुन्दुभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iha dyumattamaṃ vada yajatāmiva dundubhiḥ ||
Translation: Here give thou forth thy clearest sound, loud as the drum of conquerors.

Sanskit Text: उत सम ते वनस्पते वातो वि वात्यग्रमित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta sma te vanaspate vāto vi vātyaghramit |
Translation: 6 O Sovran of the Forest, as the wind blows soft in front of thee,

Sanskit Text: अथो इन्द्राय पातवे सुनु सोममुलूखल ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atho indrāya pātave sunu somamulūkhala ||
Translation: Mortar, for Indra press thou forth the Soma juice that he may drink.

Sanskit Text: आयजी वाजसातमा ता हयुच्चा विजर्भ्र्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āyajī vājasātamā tā hyuccā vijarbhṛtaḥ |
Translation: 7 Best strength-givers, ye stretch wide jaws, O Sacrificial Implements,

Sanskit Text: हरी इवान्धांसि बप्सता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: harī ivāndhāṃsi bapsatā ||
Translation: Like two bay horses champing herbs.

Sanskit Text: ता नो अद्य वनस्पती रष्वाव रष्वेभिः सोत्र्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā no adya vanaspatī ṛṣvāv ṛṣvebhiḥ sotṛbhiḥ |
Translation: 8 Ye Sovrans of the Forest, both swift, with swift pressers press to-day

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय मधुमत सुतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya madhumat sutam ||
Translation: Sweet Soma juice for Indra's drink.

Sanskit Text: उच्छिष्टं चम्वोर्भर सोमं पवित्र आ सर्ज |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ucchiṣṭaṃ camvorbhara somaṃ pavitra ā sṛja |
Translation: 9 Take up in beakers what remains: the Soma on the filter pour,

Sanskit Text: नि धेहि गोरधि तवचि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni dhehi ghoradhi tvaci ||
Translation: and on the ox-hide set the dregs.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने परथमो अङगिरा रषिर्देवो देवानामभवः शिवः सखा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne prathamo aṅghirā ṛṣirdevo devānāmabhavaḥ śivaḥ sakhā |
Translation: 1 Thou, Agni, wast the earliest Aṅgiras, a Seer; thou wast, a God thyself, the Gods’ auspicious Friend.

Sanskit Text: तव वरते कवयो विद्मनापसो.अजायन्त मरुतो भराजद्र्ष्टयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava vrate kavayo vidmanāpaso.ajāyanta maruto bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ ||
Translation: After thy holy ordinance the Maruts, sage, active through wisdom, with their glittering spears, were born.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने परथमो अङगिरस्तमः कविर्देवानां परि भूषसिव्रतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne prathamo aṅghirastamaḥ kavirdevānāṃ pari bhūṣasivratam |
Translation: 2 O Agni, thou, the best and earliest Aṅgiras, fulfillest as a Sage the holy law of Gods.

Sanskit Text: विभुर्विश्वस्मै भुवनाय मेधिरो दविमाता शयुः कतिधा चिदायवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vibhurviśvasmai bhuvanāya medhiro dvimātā śayuḥ katidhā cidāyave ||
Translation: Sprung from two mothers, wise, through all existence spread, resting in many a place for sake of living man.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने परथमो मातरिश्वन आविर्भव सुक्रतूया विवस्वते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne prathamo mātariśvana āvirbhava sukratūyā vivasvate |
Translation: 3 To Mātariśvan first thou, Agni, wast disclosed, and to Vivasvān through thy noble inward power.

Sanskit Text: अरेजेतां रोदसी होत्र्वूर्ये.असघ्नोर्भारमयजो महोवसो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arejetāṃ rodasī hotṛvūrye.asaghnorbhāramayajo mahovaso ||
Translation: Heaven and Earth, Vasu! shook at the choosing of the Priest: the burthen thou didst bear, didst worship mighty Gods.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने मनवे दयामवाशयः पुरूरवसे सुक्र्ते सुक्र्त्तरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne manave dyāmavāśayaḥ purūravase sukṛte sukṛttaraḥ |
Translation: 4 Agni thou madest heaven to thunder for mankind; thou, yet more pious, for pious Purūravas.

Sanskit Text: शवात्रेण यत पित्रोर्मुच्यसे पर्या तवा पूर्वमनयन्नापरं पुनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śvātreṇa yat pitrormucyase paryā tvā pūrvamanayannāparaṃ punaḥ ||
Translation: When thou art rapidly freed from thy parents, first eastward they bear thee round, and, after, to the west.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने वर्षभः पुष्टिवर्धन उद्यतस्रुचे भवसि शरवाय्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne vṛṣabhaḥ puṣṭivardhana udyatasruce bhavasi śravāyyaḥ |
Translation: 5 Thou, Agni, art a Bull who makes our store increase, to be invoked by him who lifts the ladle up.

Sanskit Text: य आहुतिं परि वेदा वषट्क्र्तिमेकायुरग्रे विश आविवाससि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya āhutiṃ pari vedā vaṣaṭkṛtimekāyuraghre viśa āvivāsasi ||
Translation: Well knowing the oblation with the hallowing word, uniting all who live, thou lightenest first our folk

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने वर्जिनवर्तनिं नरं सक्मन पिपर्षि विदथे विचर्षणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne vṛjinavartaniṃ naraṃ sakman piparṣi vidathe vicarṣaṇe |
Translation: 6 Agni, thou savest in the synod when pursued e’en him, farseeing One! who walks in evil ways.

Sanskit Text: यः शूरसाता परितक्म्ये धने दभ्रेभिश्चित सम्र्ताहंसि भूयसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ śūrasātā paritakmye dhane dabhrebhiścit samṛtāhaṃsi bhūyasaḥ ||
Translation: Thou, when the heroes fight for spoil which men rush, round, slayest in war the many by the hands of few.

Sanskit Text: तवं तमग्ने अम्र्तत्व उत्तमे मर्तं दधासि शरवसे दिवे दिवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tamaghne amṛtatva uttame martaṃ dadhāsi śravase dive dive |
Translation: 7 For glory, Agni, day by day, thou liftest up the mortal man to highest immortality,

Sanskit Text: यस्तात्र्षाण उभयाय जन्मने मयः कर्णोषि परया च सूरये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yastātṛṣāṇa ubhayāya janmane mayaḥ kṛṇoṣi prayaā ca sūraye ||
Translation: Even thou who yearning for both races givest them great bliss, and to the prince grantest abundant food.

Sanskit Text: तवं नो अग्ने सनये धनानां यशसं कारुं कर्णुहि सतवानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ no aghne sanaye dhanānāṃ yaśasaṃ kāruṃ kṛṇuhi stavānaḥ |
Translation: 8 O Agni, highly lauded, make our singer famous that he may win us store of riches:

Sanskit Text: रध्याम कर्मापसा नवेन देवैर्द्यावाप्र्थिवी परावतं नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛdhyāma karmāpasā navena devairdyāvāpṛthivī prāvataṃ naḥ ||
Translation: May we improve the rite with new performance. O Earth and Heaven, with all the Gods, protect us.

Sanskit Text: तवं नो अग्ने पित्रोरुपस्थ आ देवो देवेष्वनवद्य जाग्र्विः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ no aghne pitrorupastha ā devo deveṣvanavadya jāghṛviḥ |
Translation: 9 O blameless Agni lying in thy Parents' lap, a God among the Gods, be watchful for our good.

Sanskit Text: तनूक्र्द बोधि परमतिश्च कारवे तवं कल्याण वसु विश्वमोपिषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tanūkṛd bodhi pramatiśca kārave tvaṃ kalyāṇa vasu viśvamopiṣe ||
Translation: Former of bodies, be the singer's Providence: all good things hast thou sown for him, auspicious One!

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने परमतिस्त्वं पितासि नस्त्वं वयस्क्र्त तव जामयो वयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne pramatistvaṃ pitāsi nastvaṃ vayaskṛt tava jāmayo vayam |
Translation: 10 Agni, thou art our Providence, our Father thou: we are thy brethren and thou art our spring of life.

Sanskit Text: सं तवा रायः शतिनः सं सहस्रिणः सुवीरं यन्ति वरतपामदाभ्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ tvā rāyaḥ śatinaḥ saṃ sahasriṇaḥ suvīraṃ yanti vratapāmadābhya ||
Translation: In thee, rich in good heroes, guard of high decrees, meet hundred, thousand treasures, O infallible!

Sanskit Text: तवामग्ने परथममायुमायवे देवा अक्र्ण्वन नहुषस्य विश्पतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmaghne prathamamāyumāyave devā akṛṇvan nahuṣasya viśpatim |
Translation: 11 Thee, Agni, have the Gods made the first living One for living man, Lord of the house of Nahuṣa.

Sanskit Text: इळामक्र्ण्वन मनुषस्य शासनीं पितुर्यत पुत्रो ममकस्य जायते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iḷāmakṛṇvan manuṣasya śāsanīṃ pituryat putro mamakasya jāyate ||
Translation: Iḷā they made the teacher of the sons of men, what time a Son was born to the father of my race.

Sanskit Text: तवं नो अग्ने तव देव पायुभिर्मघोनो रक्ष तन्वश्च वन्द्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ no aghne tava deva pāyubhirmaghono rakṣa tanvaśca vandya |
Translation: 12 Worthy to be revered, O Agni, God, preserve our wealthy patrons with thy succours, and ourselves.

Sanskit Text: तराता तोकस्य तनये गवामस्यनिमेषं रक्षमाणस्तव वरते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trātā tokasya tanaye ghavāmasyanimeṣaṃ rakṣamāṇastava vrate ||
Translation: Guard of our seed art thou, aiding our cows to bear, incessantly protecting in thy holy way.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने यज्यवे पायुरन्तरो.अनिषङगाय चतुरक्ष इध्यसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne yajyave pāyurantaro.aniṣaṅghāya caturakṣa idhyase |
Translation: 13 Agni, thou art a guard close to the pious man; kindled art thou, four-eyed! for him who is unarmed.

Sanskit Text: यो रातहव्यो.अव्र्काय धायसे कीरेश्चिन मन्त्रं मनसावनोषि तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo rātahavyo.avṛkāya dhāyase kīreścin mantraṃ manasāvanoṣi tam ||
Translation: With fond heart thou acceptest e’en the poor man's prayer, when he hath brought his gift to gain security.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्न उरुशंसाय वाघते सपार्हं यद रेक्णः परमं वनोषि तत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghna uruśaṃsāya vāghate spārhaṃ yad rekṇaḥ paramaṃ vanoṣi tat |
Translation: 14 Thou, Agni gainest for the loudly-praising priest the highest wealth, the object of a man's desire.

Sanskit Text: आध्रस्य चित परमतिरुच्यसे पिता पर पाकंशास्सि पर दिशो विदुष्टरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādhrasya cit pramatirucyase pitā pra pākaṃśāssi pra diśo viduṣṭaraḥ ||
Translation: Thou art called Father, caring even for the weak, and wisest, to the simple one thou teachest lore.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने परयतदक्षिणं नरं वर्मेव सयूतं परि पासि विश्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne prayatadakṣiṇaṃ naraṃ varmeva syūtaṃ pari pāsi viśvataḥ |
Translation: 15 Agni, the man who giveth guerdon to the priests, like well-sewn armour thou guardest on every side.

Sanskit Text: सवादुक्षद्मा यो वसतौ सयोनक्र्ज्जीवयाजं यजते सोपमा दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svādukṣadmā yo vasatau syonakṛjjīvayājaṃ yajate sopamā divaḥ ||
Translation: He who with grateful food shows kindness in his house, an offerer to the living, is the type of heaven.

Sanskit Text: इमामग्ने शरणिं मीम्र्षो न इममध्वानं यमगाम दूरात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imāmaghne śaraṇiṃ mīmṛṣo na imamadhvānaṃ yamaghāma dūrāt |
Translation: 16 Pardon, we pray, this sin of ours, O Agni,—the path which we have trodden, widely straying,

Sanskit Text: आपिः पिता परमतिः सोम्यानां भर्मिरस्य रषिक्र्न मर्त्यानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpiḥ pitā pramatiḥ somyānāṃ bhṛmirasy ṛṣikṛn martyānām ||
Translation: Dear Friend and Father, caring for the pious, who speedest nigh and who inspirest mortals.

Sanskit Text: मनुष्वदग्ने अङगिरस्वदङगिरो ययातिवत सदने पूर्ववच्छुचे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: manuṣvadaghne aṅghirasvadaṅghiro yayātivat sadane pūrvavacchuce |
Translation: 17 As erst to Manus, to Yayāti, Aṅgiras, so Aṅgiras! pure Agni! come thou to our hall.

Sanskit Text: अछ याह्या वहा दैव्यं जनमा सादय बर्हिषि यक्षि च परियम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: acha yāhyā vahā daivyaṃ janamā sādaya barhiṣi yakṣi ca priyam ||
Translation: Bring hither the celestial host and seat them here upon the sacred grass, and offer what they love.

Sanskit Text: एतेनाग्ने बरह्मणा वाव्र्धस्व शक्ती वा यत ते चक्र्मा विदा वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etenāghne brahmaṇā vāvṛdhasva śaktī vā yat te cakṛmā vidā vā |
Translation: 18 By this our prayer be thou, O Agni, strengthened, prayer made by us after our power and knowledge.

Sanskit Text: उत पर णेष्यभि वस्यो अस्मान सं नः सर्ज सुमत्या वाजवत्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta pra ṇeṣyabhi vasyo asmān saṃ naḥ sṛja sumatyā vājavatyā ||
Translation: Lead thou us, therefore, to increasing riches; endow us with thy strength-bestowing favour.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य नु वीर्याणि पर वोचं यानि चकार परथमानि वज्री |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya nu vīryāṇi pra vocaṃ yāni cakāra prathamāni vajrī |
Translation: 1 I WILL declare the manly deeds of Indra, the first that he achieved, the Thunder-wielder.

Sanskit Text: अहन्नहिमन्वपस्ततर्द पर वक्षणा अभिनत पर्वतानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahannahimanvapastatarda pra vakṣaṇā abhinat parvatānām ||
Translation: He slew the Dragon, then disclosed the waters, and cleft the channels of the mountain torrents.

Sanskit Text: अहन्नहिं पर्वते शिश्रियाणं तवष्टास्मै वज्रं सवर्यं ततक्ष |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahannahiṃ parvate śiśriyāṇaṃ tvaṣṭāsmai vajraṃ svaryaṃ tatakṣa |
Translation: 2 He slew the Dragon lying on the mountain: his heavenly bolt of thunder Tvaṣṭar fashioned.

Sanskit Text: वाश्रा इव धेनवः सयन्दमाना अञ्जः समुद्रमव जग्मुरापः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāśrā iva dhenavaḥ syandamānā añjaḥ samudramava jaghmurāpaḥ ||
Translation: Like lowing kine in rapid flow descending the waters glided downward to the ocean.

Sanskit Text: वर्षायमाणो.अव्र्णीत सोमं तरिकद्रुकेष्वपिबत सुतस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣāyamāṇo.avṛṇīta somaṃ trikadrukeṣvapibat sutasya |
Translation: 3 Impetuous as a bull, he chose the Soma and in three sacred beakers drank the juices.

Sanskit Text: आसायकं मघवादत्त वज्रमहन्नेनं परथमजामहीनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsāyakaṃ maghavādatta vajramahannenaṃ prathamajāmahīnām ||
Translation: Maghavan grasped the thunder for his weapon, and smote to death this firstborn of the dragons.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्राहन परथमजामहीनामान मायिनाममिनाः परोत मायाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindrāhan prathamajāmahīnāmān māyināmamināḥ prota māyāḥ |
Translation: 4 When, Indra, thou hadst slain the dragon's firstborn, and overcome the charms of the enchanters,

Sanskit Text: आत सूर्यं जनयन दयामुषासं तादीत्नाशत्रुं न किला विवित्से ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āt sūryaṃ janayan dyāmuṣāsaṃ tādītnāśatruṃ na kilā vivitse ||
Translation: Then, giving life to Sun and Dawn and Heaven, thou foundest not one foe to stand against thee.

Sanskit Text: अहन वर्त्रं वर्त्रतरं वयंसमिन्द्रो वज्रेण महता वधेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahan vṛtraṃ vṛtrataraṃ vyaṃsamindro vajreṇa mahatā vadhena |
Translation: 5 Indra with his own great and deadly thunder smote into pieces Vṛtra, worst of Vṛtras.

Sanskit Text: सकन्धांसीव कुलिशेना विव्र्क्णाहिः शयत उपप्र्क पर्थिव्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: skandhāṃsīva kuliśenā vivṛkṇāhiḥ śayata upapṛk pṛthivyāḥ ||
Translation: As trunks of trees, what time the axe hath felled them, low on the earth so lies the prostrate Dragon.

Sanskit Text: अयोद्धेव दुर्मद आ हि जुह्वे महावीरं तुविबाधं रजीषम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayoddheva durmada ā hi juhve mahāvīraṃ tuvibādhaṃ ṛjīṣam |
Translation: 6 He, like a mad weak warrior, challenged Indra, the great impetuous many-slaying Hero.

Sanskit Text: नातारीदस्य सम्र्तिं वधानां सं रुजानाः पिपिषैन्द्रशत्रुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nātārīdasya samṛtiṃ vadhānāṃ saṃ rujānāḥ pipiṣaindraśatruḥ ||
Translation: He, brooking not the clashing of the weapons, crushed—Indra's foe—the shattered forts in falling.

Sanskit Text: अपादहस्तो अप्र्तन्यदिन्द्रमास्य वज्रमधि सानौ जघान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apādahasto apṛtanyadindramāsya vajramadhi sānau jaghāna |
Translation: 7 Footless and handless still he challenged Indra, who smote him with his bolt between the shoulders.

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्णो वध्रिः परतिमानं बुभूषन पुरुत्रा वर्त्रो अशयद वयस्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṇo vadhriḥ pratimānaṃ bubhūṣan purutrā vṛtro aśayad vyastaḥ ||
Translation: Emasculate yet claiming manly vigour, thus Vṛtra lay with scattered limbs dissevered.

Sanskit Text: नदं न भिन्नममुया शयानं मनो रुहाणा अति यन्त्यापः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nadaṃ na bhinnamamuyā śayānaṃ mano ruhāṇā ati yantyāpaḥ |
Translation: 8 There as he lies like a bank-bursting river, the waters taking courage flow above him.

Sanskit Text: याश्चिद वर्त्रो महिना पर्यतिष्ठत तासामहिः पत्सुतःशीर्बभूव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāścid vṛtro mahinā paryatiṣṭhat tāsāmahiḥ patsutaḥśīrbabhūva ||
Translation: The Dragon lies beneath the feet of torrents which Vṛtra with his greatness had encompassed.

Sanskit Text: नीचावया अभवद वर्त्रपुत्रेन्द्रो अस्या अव वधर्जभार |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nīcāvayā abhavad vṛtraputrendro asyā ava vadharjabhāra |
Translation: 9 Then humbled was the strength of Vṛtra's mother: Indra hath cast his deadly bolt against her.

Sanskit Text: उत्तरा सूरधरः पुत्र आसीद दानुः शये सहवत्सा न धेनुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uttarā sūradharaḥ putra āsīd dānuḥ śaye sahavatsā na dhenuḥ ||
Translation: The mother was above, the son was under and like a cow beside her calf lay Danu.

Sanskit Text: अतिष्ठन्तीनामनिवेशनानां काष्ठानां मध्ये निहितंशरीरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atiṣṭhantīnāmaniveśanānāṃ kāṣṭhānāṃ madhye nihitaṃśarīram |
Translation: 10 Rolled in the midst of never-ceasing currents flowing without a rest for ever onward.

Sanskit Text: वर्त्रस्य निण्यं वि चरन्त्यापो दीर्घं तम आशयदिन्द्रशत्रुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛtrasya niṇyaṃ vi carantyāpo dīrghaṃ tama āśayadindraśatruḥ ||
Translation: The waters bear off Vṛtra's nameless body: the foe of Indra sank to during darkness.

Sanskit Text: दासपत्नीरहिगोपा अतिष्ठन निरुद्धा आपः पणिनेव गावः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dāsapatnīrahighopā atiṣṭhan niruddhā āpaḥ paṇineva ghāvaḥ |
Translation: 11 Guarded by Ahi stood the thralls of Dāsas, the waters stayed like kine held by the robber.

Sanskit Text: अपां बिलमपिहितं यदासीद वर्त्रं जघन्वानपतद ववार ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāṃ bilamapihitaṃ yadāsīd vṛtraṃ jaghanvānapatad vavāra ||
Translation: But he, when he had smitten Vṛtra, opened the cave wherein the floods had been imprisoned.

Sanskit Text: अश्व्यो वारो अभवस्तदिन्द्र सर्के यत तवा परत्यहन देव एकः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvyo vāro abhavastadindra sṛke yat tvā pratyahan deva ekaḥ |
Translation: 12 A horse's tail wast thou when he, O Indra, smote on thy bolt; thou, God without a second,

Sanskit Text: अजयो गा अजयः शूर सोममवास्र्जः सर्तवे सप्त सिन्धून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajayo ghā ajayaḥ śūra somamavāsṛjaḥ sartave sapta sindhūn ||
Translation: Thou hast won back the kine, hast won the Soma; thou hast let loose to flow the Seven Rivers.

Sanskit Text: नास्मै विद्युन न तन्यतुः सिषेध न यां मिहमकिरद धरादुनिं च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāsmai vidyun na tanyatuḥ siṣedha na yāṃ mihamakirad dhrāduniṃ ca |
Translation: 13 Nothing availed him lightning, nothing thunder, hailstorm or mist which had spread around him:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रश्च यद युयुधाते अहिश्चोतापरीभ्यो मघवा वि जिग्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraśca yad yuyudhāte ahiścotāparībhyo maghavā vi jighye ||
Translation: When Indra and the Dragon strove in battle, Maghavan gained the victory for ever.

Sanskit Text: अहेर्यातारं कमपश्य इन्द्र हर्दि यत ते जघ्नुषो भीरगछत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aheryātāraṃ kamapaśya indra hṛdi yat te jaghnuṣo bhīraghachat |
Translation: 14 Whom sawest thou to avenge the Dragon, Indra, that fear possessed thy heart when thou hadst slain him;

Sanskit Text: नव च यन नवतिं च सरवन्तीः शयेनो न भीतोतरो रजांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nava ca yan navatiṃ ca sravantīḥ śyeno na bhītoataro rajāṃsi ||
Translation: That, like a hawk affrighted through the regions, thou crossedst nine-and-ninety flowing rivers?

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो यातो.अवसितस्य राजा शमस्य च शर्ङगिणो वज्रबाहुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro yāto.avasitasya rājā śamasya ca śṛṅghiṇo vajrabāhuḥ |
Translation: 15 Indra is King of all that moves and moves not, of creatures tame and horned, the Thunder-wielder.

Sanskit Text: सेदु राजा कषयति चर्षणीनामरान न नेमिः परि ता बभूव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sedu rājā kṣayati carṣaṇīnāmarān na nemiḥ pari tā babhūva ||
Translation: Over all living men he rules as Sovran, containing all as spokes within the felly.

Sanskit Text: एतायामोप गव्यन्त इन्द्रमस्माकं सु परमतिं वाव्र्धाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etāyāmopa ghavyanta indramasmākaṃ su pramatiṃ vāvṛdhāti |
Translation: 1 Come, fain for booty let us seek to Indra: yet more shall he increase his care that guides us.

Sanskit Text: अनाम्र्णः कुविदादस्य रायो गवां केतं परमावर्जते नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anāmṛṇaḥ kuvidādasya rāyo ghavāṃ ketaṃ paramāvarjate naḥ ||
Translation: Will not the Indestructible endow us with perfect knowledge of this wealth, of cattle?

Sanskit Text: उपेदहं धनदामप्रतीतं जुष्टं न शयेनो वसतिम्पतामि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upedahaṃ dhanadāmapratītaṃ juṣṭaṃ na śyeno vasatimpatāmi |
Translation: 2 I fly to him invisible Wealth-giver as flies the falcon to his cherished eyrie,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं नमस्यन्नुपमेभिरर्कैर्यः सतोत्र्भ्यो हव्यो अस्ति यामन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ namasyannupamebhirarkairyaḥ stotṛbhyo havyo asti yāman ||
Translation: With fairest hymns of praise adoring Indra, whom those who laud him must invoke in battle.

Sanskit Text: नि सर्वसेन इषुधीन्रसक्त समर्यो गा अजति यस्य वष्टि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni sarvasena iṣudhīnrasakta samaryo ghā ajati yasya vaṣṭi |
Translation: 3 Mid all his host, he bindeth on the quiver: he driveth cattle from what foe he pleaseth:

Sanskit Text: चोष्कूयमाण इन्द्र भूरि वामं मा पणिर्भूरस्मदधि परव्र्द्ध ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: coṣkūyamāṇa indra bhūri vāmaṃ mā paṇirbhūrasmadadhi pravṛddha ||
Translation: Gathering up great store of riches, Indra. be thou no trafficker with us, most mighty.

Sanskit Text: वधीर्हि दस्युं धनिनं घनेननेकश्चरन्नुपशाकेभिरिन्द्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vadhīrhi dasyuṃ dhaninaṃ ghanenanekaścarannupaśākebhirindra |
Translation: 4 Thou slewest with thy bolt the wealthy Dasyu, alone, yet going with thy helpers, Indra!

Sanskit Text: धनोरधि विषुणक ते वयायन्नयज्वनः सनकाः परेतिमीयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhanoradhi viṣuṇak te vyāyannayajvanaḥ sanakāḥ pretimīyuḥ ||
Translation: Far from the floor of heaven in all directions, the ancient riteless ones fled to destruction.

Sanskit Text: परा चिच्छीर्षा वव्र्जुस्त इन्द्रायज्वानो यज्वभिः सपर्धमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parā cicchīrṣā vavṛjusta indrāyajvāno yajvabhiḥ spardhamānāḥ |
Translation: 5 Fighting with pious worshippers, the riteless turned and fled, Indra! with averted faces.

Sanskit Text: पर यद दिवो हरिव सथातरुग्र निरव्रतानधमोरोदस्योः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yad divo hariva sthātarughra niravratānadhamorodasyoḥ ||
Translation: When thou, fierce Lord of the Bay Steeds, the Stayer, blewest from earth and heaven and sky the godless.

Sanskit Text: अयुयुत्सन्ननवद्यस्य सेनामयातयन्त कषितयो नवग्वाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayuyutsannanavadyasya senāmayātayanta kṣitayo navaghvāḥ |
Translation: 6 They met in fight the army of the blameless: then the Navagvas put forth all their power.

Sanskit Text: वर्षायुधो न वध्रयो निरष्टाः परवद्भिरिन्द्राच्चितयन्त आयन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣāyudho na vadhrayo niraṣṭāḥ pravadbhirindrāccitayanta āyan ||
Translation: They, like emasculates with men contending, fled, conscious, by steep paths from Indra, scattered.

Sanskit Text: तवमेतान रुदतो जक्षतश्चायोधयो रजस इन्द्र पारे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvametān rudato jakṣataścāyodhayo rajasa indra pāre |
Translation: 7 Whether they weep or laugh, thou hast o’erthrown them, O Indra, on the sky's extremest limit.

Sanskit Text: अवादहो दिव आ दस्युमुच्चा पर सुन्वतः सतुवतः शंसमावः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avādaho diva ā dasyumuccā pra sunvataḥ stuvataḥ śaṃsamāvaḥ ||
Translation: The Dasyu thou hast burned from heaven, and welcomed the prayer of him who pours the juice and lauds thee.

Sanskit Text: चक्राणासः परीणहं पर्थिव्या हिरण्येन मणिना शुम्भमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakrāṇāsaḥ parīṇahaṃ pṛthivyā hiraṇyena maṇinā śumbhamānāḥ |
Translation: 8 Adorned with their array of gold and jewels, they o’er the earth a covering veil extended.

Sanskit Text: न हिन्वानासस्तितिरुस्त इन्द्रं परि सपशो अदधात सूर्येण ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na hinvānāsastitirusta indraṃ pari spaśo adadhāt sūryeṇa ||
Translation: Although they hastened, they o’ercame not Indra: their spies he compassed with the Sun of morning.

Sanskit Text: परि यदिन्द्र रोदसी उभे अबुभोजीर्महिना विश्वतः सीम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari yadindra rodasī ubhe abubhojīrmahinā viśvataḥ sīm |
Translation: 9 As thou enjoyest heaven and earth, O Indra, on every side surrounded with thy greatness,

Sanskit Text: अमन्यमानानभि मन्यमानैर्निर्ब्रह्मभिरधमो दस्युमिन्द्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: amanyamānānabhi manyamānairnirbrahmabhiradhamo dasyumindra ||
Translation: So thou with priests hast blown away the Dasyu, and those who worship not with those who worship.

Sanskit Text: न ये दिवः पर्थिव्या अन्तमापुर्न मायाभिर्धनदां पर्यभूवन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na ye divaḥ pṛthivyā antamāpurna māyābhirdhanadāṃ paryabhūvan |
Translation: 10 They who pervaded earth's extremest limit subdued not with their charms the Wealth-bestower:

Sanskit Text: युजं वज्रं वर्षभश्चक्र इन्द्रो निर्ज्योतिषा तमसो गा अदुक्षत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yujaṃ vajraṃ vṛṣabhaścakra indro nirjyotiṣā tamaso ghā adukṣat ||
Translation: Indra, the Bull, made his ally the thunder, and with its light milked cows from out the darkness.

Sanskit Text: अनु सवधामक्षरन्नापो अस्यावर्धत मध्य आ नाव्यानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu svadhāmakṣarannāpo asyāvardhata madhya ā nāvyānām |
Translation: 11 The waters flowed according to their nature; he raid the navigable streams waxed mighty.

Sanskit Text: सध्रीचीनेन मनसा तमिन्द्र ओजिष्ठेन हन्मनाहन्नभि दयून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadhrīcīnena manasā tamindra ojiṣṭhena hanmanāhannabhi dyūn ||
Translation: Then Indra, with his spirit concentrated, smote him for ever with his strongest weapon.

Sanskit Text: नयाविध्यदिलीबिशस्य दर्ल्हा वि शर्ङगिणमभिनच्छुष्णमिन्द्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nyāvidhyadilībiśasya dṛlhā vi śṛṅghiṇamabhinacchuṣṇamindraḥ |
Translation: 12 Indra broke through Ilībiśa's strong castles, and Śuṣṇa with his horn he cut to pieces:

Sanskit Text: यावत तरो मघवन यावदोजो वज्रेण शत्रुमवधीः पर्तन्युम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāvat taro maghavan yāvadojo vajreṇa śatrumavadhīḥ pṛtanyum ||
Translation: Thou, Maghavan, for all his might and swiftness, slewest thy fighting foeman with thy thunder

Sanskit Text: अभि सिध्मो अजिगादस्य शत्रून वि तिग्मेन वर्षभेण पुरो.अभेत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi sidhmo ajighādasya śatrūn vi tighmena vṛṣabheṇa puro.abhet |
Translation: 13 Fierce on his enemies fell Indra's weapon: with. his sharp bull he rent their forts in pieces.

Sanskit Text: सं वज्रेणास्र्जद वर्त्रमिन्द्रः पर सवां मतिमतिरच्छाशदानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ vajreṇāsṛjad vṛtramindraḥ pra svāṃ matimatiracchāśadānaḥ ||
Translation: He with his thunderbolt dealt blows on Vṛtra; and conquered, executing all his purpose.

Sanskit Text: आवः कुत्सम इन्द्र यस्मि चाकन परावो युध्यन्तं वर्षभं दशद्युम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvaḥ kutsam indra yasmi cākan prāvo yudhyantaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ daśadyum |
Translation: 14 Indra, thou helpest Kutsa whom thou lovedst, and guardedst brave Daśadyu when he battled,

Sanskit Text: शफच्युतो रेणुर नक्षत दयाम उच छवैत्रेयो नर्षाह्याय तस्थौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaphacyuto reṇur nakṣata dyām uc chvaitreyo nṛṣāhyāya tasthau ||
Translation: The dust of trampling horses rose to heaven, and Śvitrā's son stood up again for conquest.

Sanskit Text: आवः शमं वर्षभं तुग्र्यासु कषेत्रजेषे मघवञ्छ्वित्र्यं गाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvaḥ śamaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ tughryāsu kṣetrajeṣe maghavañchvitryaṃ ghām |
Translation: 15 Śvitrā's mild steer, O Maghavan thou helpest in combat for the land, mid Tugra's houses.

Sanskit Text: जयोक चिद अत्र तस्थिवांसो अक्रञ्छत्रूयताम अधरा वेदनाकः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyok cid atra tasthivāṃso akrañchatrūyatām adharā vedanākaḥ ||
Translation: Long stood they there before the task was ended: thou wast the master of the foemen's treasure.

Sanskit Text: तरिश चिन नो अद्या भवतं नवेदसा विभुर वां याम उत रातिर अश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: triś cin no adyā bhavataṃ navedasā vibhur vāṃ yāma uta rātir aśvinā |
Translation: 1 Ye who observe this day be with us even thrice: far-stretching is you bounty, Aśvins and your course.

Sanskit Text: युवोर हि यन्त्रं हिम्येव वाससो ऽभयायंसेन्या भवतम मनीषिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvor hi yantraṃ himyeva vāsaso 'bhyāyaṃsenyā bhavatam manīṣibhiḥ ||
Translation: To you, as to a cloak in winter, we cleave close: you are to be drawn nigh unto us by the wise.

Sanskit Text: तरयः पवयो मधुवाहने रथे सोमस्य वेनाम अनु विश्व इद विदुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trayaḥ pavayo madhuvāhane rathe somasya venām anu viśva id viduḥ |
Translation: 2 Three are the fellies in your honey-bearing car, that travels after Soma's loved one, as all know.

Sanskit Text: तरय सकम्भास सकभितास आरभे तरिर नक्तं याथस तरिर व अश्विना दिवा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: traya skambhāsa skabhitāsa ārabhe trir naktaṃ yāthas trir v aśvinā divā ||
Translation: Three are the pillars set upon it for support: thrice journey ye by night, O Aśvins, thrice by day.

Sanskit Text: समाने अहन तरिर अवद्यगोहना तरिर अद्य यज्ञम मधुना मिमिक्षतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samāne ahan trir avadyaghohanā trir adya yajñam madhunā mimikṣatam |
Translation: 3 Thrice in the self-same day, ye Gods who banish want, sprinkle ye thrice to-day our sacrifice with meath;

Sanskit Text: तरिर वाजवतीर इषो अश्विना युवं दोषा अस्मभ्यम उषसश च पिन्वतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trir vājavatīr iṣo aśvinā yuvaṃ doṣā asmabhyam uṣasaś ca pinvatam ||
Translation: And thrice vouchsafe us store of food with plenteous strength, at evening, O ye Aśvins, and at break of day.

Sanskit Text: तरिर वर्तिर यातं तरिर अनुव्रते जने तरिः सुप्राव्येत्रेधेव शिक्षतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trir vartir yātaṃ trir anuvrate jane triḥ suprāvyetredheva śikṣatam |
Translation: 4 Thrice come ye to our home, thrice to the righteous folk, thrice triply aid the man who well deserves your help.

Sanskit Text: तरिर नान्द्यं वहतम अश्विना युवं तरिः पर्क्षो अस्मे अक्षरेव पिन्वतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trir nāndyaṃ vahatam aśvinā yuvaṃ triḥ pṛkṣo asme akṣareva pinvatam ||
Translation: Thrice, O ye Aśvins, bring us what shall make us glad; thrice send us store of food as nevermore to fail.

Sanskit Text: तरिर नो रयिं वहतम अश्विना युवं तरिर देवताता तरिर उतावतं धियः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trir no rayiṃ vahatam aśvinā yuvaṃ trir devatātā trir utāvataṃ dhiyaḥ |
Translation: 5 Thrice, O ye Aśvins, bring to us abundant wealth: thrice in the Gods’ assembly, thrice assist our thoughts.

Sanskit Text: तरिः सौभगत्वं तरिर उत शरवांसि नस तरिष्ठं वां सूरे दुहिता रुहद रथम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: triḥ saubhaghatvaṃ trir uta śravāṃsi nas triṣṭhaṃ vāṃ sūre duhitā ruhad ratham ||
Translation: Thrice, grant ye us prosperity, thrice grant us fame; for the Sun's daughter hath mounted your three-wheeled car.

Sanskit Text: तरिर नो अश्विना दिव्यानि भेषजा तरिः पार्थिवानि तरिर उ दत्तम अद्भ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trir no aśvinā divyāni bheṣajā triḥ pārthivāni trir u dattam adbhyaḥ |
Translation: 6 Thrice, Aśvins, grant to us the heavenly medicines, thrice those of earth and thrice those that the waters hold,

Sanskit Text: ओमानं शंयोर ममकाय सूनवे तरिधातु शर्म वहतं शुभस पती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: omānaṃ śaṃyor mamakāya sūnave tridhātu śarma vahataṃ śubhas patī ||
Translation: Favour and health and strength bestow upon my son; triple protection, Lords of Splendour, grant to him.

Sanskit Text: तरिर नो अश्विना यजता दिवे-दिवे परि तरिधातु पर्थिवीम अशायतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trir no aśvinā yajatā dive-dive pari tridhātu pṛthivīm aśāyatam |
Translation: 7 Thrice are ye to be worshipped day by day by us: thrice, O ye Aśvins, ye travel around the earth.

Sanskit Text: तिस्रो नासत्या रथ्या परावत आत्मेव वातः सवसराणि गछतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisro nāsatyā rathyā parāvata ātmeva vātaḥ svasarāṇi ghachatam ||
Translation: Car-borne from far away, O ye Nāsatyas, come, like vital air to bodies, come ye to the three.

Sanskit Text: तरिर अश्विना सिन्धुभिः सप्तमात्र्भिस तरय आहावास तरेधा हविष कर्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trir aśvinā sindhubhiḥ saptamātṛbhis traya āhāvās tredhā haviṣ kṛtam |
Translation: 8 Thrice, O ye Aśvins, with the Seven Mother Streams; three are the jars, the triple offering is prepared.

Sanskit Text: तिस्रः पर्थिवीर उपरि परवा दिवो नाकं रक्षेथे दयुभिर अक्तुभिर हितम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisraḥ pṛthivīr upari pravā divo nākaṃ rakṣethe dyubhir aktubhir hitam ||
Translation: Three are the worlds, and moving on above the sky ye guard the firm-set vault of heaven through days and nights.

Sanskit Text: कव तरी चक्रा तरिव्र्तो रथस्य कव तरयो वन्धुरो ये सनीळाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kva trī cakrā trivṛto rathasya kva trayo vandhuro ye sanīḷāḥ |
Translation: 9 Where are the three wheels of your triple chariot, where are the three seats thereto firmly fastened?

Sanskit Text: कदा योगो वाजिनो रासभस्य येन यज्ञं नासत्योपयाथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadā yogho vājino rāsabhasya yena yajñaṃ nāsatyopayāthaḥ ||
Translation: When will ye yoke the mighty ass that draws it, to bring you to our sacrifice. Nāsatyas?

Sanskit Text: आ नासत्या गछतं हूयते हविर मध्वः पिबतम मधुपेभिर आसभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā nāsatyā ghachataṃ hūyate havir madhvaḥ pibatam madhupebhir āsabhiḥ |
Translation: 10 Nāsatyas, come: the sacred gift is offered up; drink the sweet juice with lips that know the sweetness well.

Sanskit Text: युवोर हि पूर्वं सवितोषसो रथम रताय चित्रं घर्तवन्तम इष्यति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvor hi pūrvaṃ savitoṣaso ratham ṛtāya citraṃ ghṛtavantam iṣyati ||
Translation: Savitar sends, before the dawn of day, your car, fraught with oil, various-coloured, to our sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: आ नासत्या तरिभिर एकादशैर इह देवेभिर यातम मधुपेयम अश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā nāsatyā tribhir ekādaśair iha devebhir yātam madhupeyam aśvinā |
Translation: 11 Come, O Nāsatyas, with the thrice-eleven Gods; come, O ye Aśvins, to the drinking of the meath.

Sanskit Text: परायुस तारिष्टं नी रपांसि मर्क्षतं सेधतं दवेषो भवतं सचाभुवा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāyus tāriṣṭaṃ nī rapāṃsi mṛkṣataṃ sedhataṃ dveṣo bhavataṃ sacābhuvā ||
Translation: Make long our days of life, and wipe out all our sins: ward off our enemies; be with us evermore.

Sanskit Text: आ नो अश्विना तरिव्र्ता रथेनार्वाञ्चं रयिं वहतं सुवीरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no aśvinā trivṛtā rathenārvāñcaṃ rayiṃ vahataṃ suvīram |
Translation: 12 Borne in your triple car, O Aśvins, bring us present prosperity with noble offspring.

Sanskit Text: शर्ण्वन्ता वाम अवसे जोहवीमि वर्धे च नो भवतं वाजसातौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇvantā vām avase johavīmi vṛdhe ca no bhavataṃ vājasātau ||
Translation: I cry to you who hear me for protection be ye our helpers where men win the booty.

Sanskit Text: हवयाम्य अग्निम परथमं सवस्तये हवयामि मित्रावरुणाव इहावसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hvayāmy aghnim prathamaṃ svastaye hvayāmi mitrāvaruṇāv ihāvase |
Translation: 1 AGNI I first invoke for our prosperity; I call on Mitra, Varuṇa, to aid us here.

Sanskit Text: हवयामि रात्रीं जगतो निवेशनीं हवयामि देवं सवितारम ऊतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hvayāmi rātrīṃ jaghato niveśanīṃ hvayāmi devaṃ savitāram ūtaye ||
Translation: I call on Night who gives rest to all moving life; I call on Savitar the God to lend us help.

Sanskit Text: आ कर्ष्णेन रजसा वर्तमानो निवेशयन्न अम्र्तम मर्त्यं च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā kṛṣṇena rajasā vartamāno niveśayann amṛtam martyaṃ ca |
Translation: 2 Throughout the dusky firmament advancing, laying to rest the immortal and the mortal,

Sanskit Text: हिरण्ययेन सविता रथेना देवो याति भुवनानि पश्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyayena savitā rathenā devo yāti bhuvanāni paśyan ||
Translation: Borne in his golden chariot he cometh, Savitar, God who looks on every creature.

Sanskit Text: याति देवः परवता यात्य उद्वता याति शुभ्राभ्यां यजतो हरिभ्याम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāti devaḥ pravatā yāty udvatā yāti śubhrābhyāṃ yajato haribhyām |
Translation: 3 The God moves by the upward path, the downward; with two bright Bays, adorable, he journeys.

Sanskit Text: आ देवो याति सविता परावतो ऽप विश्वा दुरिता बाधमानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā devo yāti savitā parāvato 'pa viśvā duritā bādhamānaḥ ||
Translation: Savitar comes, the God from the far distance, and chases from us all distress and sorrow.

Sanskit Text: अभीव्र्तं कर्शनैर विश्वरूपं हिरण्यशम्यं यजतो बर्हन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhīvṛtaṃ kṛśanair viśvarūpaṃ hiraṇyaśamyaṃ yajato bṛhantam |
Translation: 4 His chariot decked with pearl, of various colours, lofty, with golden pole, the God hath mounted,

Sanskit Text: आस्थाद रथं सविता चित्रभानुः कर्ष्णा रजांसि तविषीं दधानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsthād rathaṃ savitā citrabhānuḥ kṛṣṇā rajāṃsi taviṣīṃ dadhānaḥ ||
Translation: The many-rayed One, Savitar the holy, bound, bearing power and might, for darksome regions.

Sanskit Text: वि जनाञ्छ्यावाः शितिपादो अख्यन रथं हिरण्यप्ररौगं वहन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi janāñchyāvāḥ śitipādo akhyan rathaṃ hiraṇyapraraughaṃ vahantaḥ |
Translation: 5 Drawing the gold-yoked car his Bays, white-footed, have manifested light to all the peoples.

Sanskit Text: शश्वद विशः सवितुर दैव्यस्योपस्थे विश्वा भुवनानि तस्थुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaśvad viśaḥ savitur daivyasyopasthe viśvā bhuvanāni tasthuḥ ||
Translation: Held in the lap of Savitar, divine One, all men, all beings have their place for ever.

Sanskit Text: तिस्रो दयावः सवितुर दवा उपस्थां एका यमस्य भुवने विराषाट |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisro dyāvaḥ savitur dvā upasthāṃ ekā yamasya bhuvane virāṣāṭ |
Translation: 6 Three heavens there are; two Savitar's, adjacent: in Yama's world is one, the home of heroes,

Sanskit Text: आणिं न रथ्यम अम्र्ताधि तस्थुर इह बरवीतु य उ तच चिकेतत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āṇiṃ na rathyam amṛtādhi tasthur iha bravītu ya u tac ciketat ||
Translation: As on a linch-pin, firm, rest things immortal: he who hath known it let him here declare it.

Sanskit Text: वि सुपर्णो अन्तरिक्षाण्य अख्यद गभीरवेपा असुरः सुनीथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi suparṇo antarikṣāṇy akhyad ghabhīravepā asuraḥ sunīthaḥ |
Translation: 7 He, strong of wing, hath lightened up the regions, deep-quivering Asura, the gentle Leader.

Sanskit Text: कवेदानीं सूर्यः कश चिकेत कतमां दयां रश्मिर अस्या ततान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kvedānīṃ sūryaḥ kaś ciketa katamāṃ dyāṃ raśmir asyā tatāna ||
Translation: Where now is Sūrya, where is one to tell us to what celestial sphere his ray hath wandered?

Sanskit Text: अष्टौ वय अख्यत ककुभः पर्थिव्यास तरी धन्व योजना सप्त सिन्धून |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṣṭau vy akhyat kakubhaḥ pṛthivyās trī dhanva yojanā sapta sindhūn |
Translation: 8 The earth's eight points his brightness hath illumined, three desert regions and the Seven Rivers.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्याक्षः सविता देव आगाद दधद रत्ना दाशुषे वार्याणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyākṣaḥ savitā deva āghād dadhad ratnā dāśuṣe vāryāṇi ||
Translation: God Savitar the gold-eyed hath come hither, giving choice treasures unto him who worships.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यपाणिः सविता विचर्षणिर उभे दयावाप्र्थिवी अन्तर ईयते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyapāṇiḥ savitā vicarṣaṇir ubhe dyāvāpṛthivī antar īyate |
Translation: 9 The golden-handed Savitar, far-seeing, goes on his way between the earth and heaven,

Sanskit Text: अपामीवाम बाधते वेति सूर्यम अभि कर्ष्णेन रजसा दयाम रणोति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāmīvām bādhate veti sūryam abhi kṛṣṇena rajasā dyām ṛṇoti ||
Translation: Drives away sickness, bids the Sun approach us, and spreads the bright sky through the darksome region.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यहस्तो असुरः सुनीथः सुम्र्ळीकः सववान यात्वर्वां |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyahasto asuraḥ sunīthaḥ sumṛḷīkaḥ svavān yātvarvāṃ |
Translation: 10 May he, gold-handed Asura, kind Leader, come hither to us with his help and favour.

Sanskit Text: अपसेधन रक्षसो यातुधानानस्थाद देवः परतिदोषं गर्णानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apasedhan rakṣaso yātudhānānasthād devaḥ pratidoṣaṃ ghṛṇānaḥ ||
Translation: Driving off Rākṣasas and Yātudhānas, the God is present, praised in hymns at evening.

Sanskit Text: ये ते पन्थाः सवितः पूर्व्यासो.अरेणवः सुक्र्ता अन्तरिक्षे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye te panthāḥ savitaḥ pūrvyāso.areṇavaḥ sukṛtā antarikṣe |
Translation: 11 O Savitar, thine ancient dustless pathways are well established in the air's mid-region:

Sanskit Text: तेभिर्नो अद्य पथिभिः सुगेभी रक्षा च नो अधि च बरूहि देव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tebhirno adya pathibhiḥ sughebhī rakṣā ca no adhi ca brūhi deva ||
Translation: O God, come by those paths so fair to travel, preserve thou us from harm this day, and bless us.

Sanskit Text: पर वो यह्वं पुरूणां विशां देवयतीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vo yahvaṃ purūṇāṃ viśāṃ devayatīnām |
Translation: 1 WITH words sent forth in holy hymns, Agni we supplicate, the Lord

Sanskit Text: अग्निं सूक्तेभिर्वचोभिरीमहे यं सीमिदन्य ईळते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ sūktebhirvacobhirīmahe yaṃ sīmidanya īḷate ||
Translation: Of many families who duly serve the Gods, yea, him whom others also praise.

Sanskit Text: जनासो अग्निं दधिरे सहोव्र्धं हविष्मन्तो विधेम ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: janāso aghniṃ dadhire sahovṛdhaṃ haviṣmanto vidhema te |
Translation: 2 Men have won Agni, him who makes their strength abound: we, with oblations, worship thee.

Sanskit Text: स तवं नो अद्य सुमना इहाविता भवा वाजेषु सन्त्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvaṃ no adya sumanā ihāvitā bhavā vājeṣu santya ||
Translation: Our gracious-minded Helper in our deeds of might, be thou, O Excellent, this day.

Sanskit Text: पर तवा दूतं वर्णीमहे होतारं विश्ववेदसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra tvā dūtaṃ vṛṇīmahe hotāraṃ viśvavedasam |
Translation: 3 Thee for our messenger we choose, thee, the Omniscient, for our Priest.

Sanskit Text: महस्ते सतो वि चरन्त्यर्चयो दिवि सप्र्शन्ति भानवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahaste sato vi carantyarcayo divi spṛśanti bhānavaḥ ||
Translation: The flames of thee the mighty are spread wide around: thy splendour reaches to the sky.

Sanskit Text: देवासस्त्वा वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा सं दूतं परत्नमिन्धते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāsastvā varuṇo mitro aryamā saṃ dūtaṃ pratnamindhate |
Translation: 4 The Gods enkindle thee their ancient messenger,—Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman.

Sanskit Text: विश्वं सो अग्ने जयति तवया धनं यस्ते ददाश मर्त्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvaṃ so aghne jayati tvayā dhanaṃ yaste dadāśa martyaḥ ||
Translation: That mortal man, O Agni, gains through thee all wealth, who hath poured offerings unto thee.

Sanskit Text: मन्द्रो होता गर्हपतिरग्ने दूतो विशामसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mandro hotā ghṛhapatiraghne dūto viśāmasi |
Translation: 5 Thou, Agni, art a cheering Priest, Lord of the House, men's messenger:

Sanskit Text: तवे विश्वा संगतानि वरता धरुवा यानि देवा अक्र्ण्वत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve viśvā saṃghatāni vratā dhruvā yāni devā akṛṇvata ||
Translation: All constant high decrees established by the Gods, gathered together, meet in thee.

Sanskit Text: तवे इदग्ने सुभगे यविष्ठ्य विश्वमा हूयते हविः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve idaghne subhaghe yaviṣṭhya viśvamā hūyate haviḥ |
Translation: 6 In thee, the auspicious One, O Agni, youthfullest, each sacred gift is offered up:

Sanskit Text: सत्वं नो अद्य सुमना उतापरं यक्षि देवान सुवीर्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satvaṃ no adya sumanā utāparaṃ yakṣi devān suvīryā ||
Translation: This day, and after, gracious, worship thou our Gods, that we may have heroic sons.

Sanskit Text: तं घेमित्था नमस्विन उप सवराजमासते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ ghemitthā namasvina upa svarājamāsate |
Translation: 7 To him in his own splendour bright draw near in worship the devout.

Sanskit Text: होत्राभिरग्निं मनुषः समिन्धते तितिर्वांसो अति सरिधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotrābhiraghniṃ manuṣaḥ samindhate titirvāṃso ati sridhaḥ ||
Translation: Men kindle Agni with their sacrificial gifts, victorious o’er the enemies.

Sanskit Text: घनन्तो वर्त्रमतरन रोदसी अप उरु कषयाय चक्रिरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghnanto vṛtramataran rodasī apa uru kṣayāya cakrire |
Translation: 8 Vṛtra they smote and slew, and made the earth and heaven and firmament a wide abode.

Sanskit Text: भुवत कण्वे वर्षा दयुम्न्याहुतः करन्ददश्वो गविष्टिषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhuvat kaṇve vṛṣā dyumnyāhutaḥ krandadaśvo ghaviṣṭiṣu ||
Translation: The glorious Bull, invoked, hath stood at Kaṇva's side: loud neighed the Steed in frays for kine.

Sanskit Text: सं सीदस्व महानसि शोचस्व देववीतमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ sīdasva mahānasi śocasva devavītamaḥ |
Translation: 9 Seat thee, for thou art mighty; shine, best entertainer of the Gods.

Sanskit Text: वि धूममग्ने अरुषं मियेध्य सर्ज परशस्त दर्शतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi dhūmamaghne aruṣaṃ miyedhya sṛja praśasta darśatam ||
Translation: Worthy of sacred food, praised Agni! loose the smoke, ruddy and beautiful to see.

Sanskit Text: यं तवा देवासो मनवे दधुरिह यजिष्ठं हव्यवाहन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ tvā devāso manave dadhuriha yajiṣṭhaṃ havyavāhana |
Translation: 10 Bearer of offerings, whom, best sacrificing Priest, the Gods for Manu's sake ordained;

Sanskit Text: यं कण्वो मेध्यातिथिर्धनस्प्र्तं यं वर्षा यमुपस्तुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ kaṇvo medhyātithirdhanaspṛtaṃ yaṃ vṛṣā yamupastutaḥ ||
Translation: Whom Kaṇva, whom Medhyātithi made the source of wealth, and Vṛṣan and Upastuta.

Sanskit Text: यमग्निं मेध्यातिथिः कण्व ईध रतादधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamaghniṃ medhyātithiḥ kaṇva īdha ṛtādadhi |
Translation: 11 Him, Agni, whom Medhyātithi, whom Kaṇva kindled for his rite,

Sanskit Text: तस्य परेषो दीदियुस्तमिमा रचस्तमग्निं वर्धयामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya preṣo dīdiyustamimā ṛcastamaghniṃ vardhayāmasi ||
Translation: Him these our songs of praise, him, Agni, we extol: his powers shine out preeminent.

Sanskit Text: रायस पूर्धि सवधावो.अस्ति हि ते.अग्ने देवेष्वाप्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyas pūrdhi svadhāvo.asti hi te.aghne deveṣvāpyam |
Translation: 12 Make our wealth perfect thou, O Agni, Lord divine: for thou hast kinship with the Gods.

Sanskit Text: तवंवाजस्य शरुत्यस्य राजसि स नो मर्ळ महानसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃvājasya śrutyasya rājasi sa no mṛḷa mahānasi ||
Translation: Thou rulest as a King o’er widely-famous strength: be good to us, for thou art great.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्व ऊ षु ण ऊतये तिष्ठा देवो न सविता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhva ū ṣu ṇa ūtaye tiṣṭhā devo na savitā |
Translation: 13 Stand up erect to lend us aid, stand up like Savitar the God:

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वोवाजस्य सनिता यदञ्जिभिर्वाघद्भिर्विह्वयामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvovājasya sanitā yadañjibhirvāghadbhirvihvayāmahe ||
Translation: Erect as strength-bestower we call aloud, with unguents and with priests, on thee.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वो नः पाह्यंहसो नि केतुना विश्वं समत्रिणं दह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvo naḥ pāhyaṃhaso ni ketunā viśvaṃ samatriṇaṃ daha |
Translation: 14 Erect, preserve us from sore trouble; with thy flame burn thou each ravening demon dead.

Sanskit Text: कर्धी न ऊर्ध्वाञ्चरथाय जीवसे विदा देवेषु नो दुवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛdhī na ūrdhvāñcarathāya jīvase vidā deveṣu no duvaḥ ||
Translation: Raise thou us up that we may walk and live: so thou shalt find our worship mid the Gods.

Sanskit Text: पाहि नो अग्ने रक्षसः पाहि धूर्तेरराव्णः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāhi no aghne rakṣasaḥ pāhi dhūrterarāvṇaḥ |
Translation: 15 Preserve us, Agni, from the fiend, preserve us from malicious wrong.

Sanskit Text: पाहि रीषत उत वा जिघांसतो बर्हद्भानो यविष्ठ्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāhi rīṣata uta vā jighāṃsato bṛhadbhāno yaviṣṭhya ||
Translation: Save us from him who fain would injure us or slay, Most Youthful, thou with lofty light.

Sanskit Text: घनेव विष्वग वि जह्यराव्णस्तपुर्जम्भ यो अस्मध्रुक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghaneva viṣvagh vi jahyarāvṇastapurjambha yo asmadhruk |
Translation: 16 Smite down as with a club, thou who hast fire for teeth, smite thou the wicked, right and left.

Sanskit Text: यो मर्त्यः शिशीते अत्यक्तुभिर्मा नः स रिपुरीशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo martyaḥ śiśīte atyaktubhirmā naḥ sa ripurīśata ||
Translation: Let not the man who plots against us in the night, nor any foe prevail o’er us.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्वव्ने सुवीर्यमग्निः कण्वाय सौभगम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirvavne suvīryamaghniḥ kaṇvāya saubhagham |
Translation: 17 Agni hath given heroic might to Kaṇva, and felicity:

Sanskit Text: अग्निः परावन मित्रोत मेध्यातिथिमग्निः साता उपस्तुतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniḥ prāvan mitrota medhyātithimaghniḥ sātā upastutam ||
Translation: Agni hath helped our friends, hath helped Medhyātithi, hath helped Upastuta to win.

Sanskit Text: अग्निना तुर्वशं यदुं परावत उग्रादेवं हवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghninā turvaśaṃ yaduṃ parāvata ughrādevaṃ havāmahe |
Translation: 18 We call on Ugradeva, Yadu, Turvaśa, by means of Agni, from afar;

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्नयन नववास्त्वं बर्हद्रथं तुर्वीतिं दस्यवे सहः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirnayan navavāstvaṃ bṛhadrathaṃ turvītiṃ dasyave sahaḥ ||
Translation: Agni, bring Navavāstva and Bṛhadratha, Turvīti, to subdue the foe.

Sanskit Text: नि तवामग्ने मनुर्दधे जयोतिर्जनाय शश्वते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni tvāmaghne manurdadhe jyotirjanāya śaśvate |
