Translation: 19 Manu hath stablished thee a light, Agni, for all the race of men:

Sanskit Text: दीदेथ कण्व रतजात उक्षितो यं नमस्यन्ति कर्ष्टयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dīdetha kaṇva ṛtajāta ukṣito yaṃ namasyanti kṛṣṭayaḥ ||
Translation: Sprung from the Law, oil-fed, for Kaṇva hast thou blazed, thou whom the people reverence.

Sanskit Text: तवेषासो अग्नेरमवन्तो अर्चयो भीमासो न परतीतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tveṣāso aghneramavanto arcayo bhīmāso na pratītaye |
Translation: 20 The flames of Agni full of splendour and of might are fearful, not to be approached.

Sanskit Text: रक्षस्विनः सदमिद यातुमावतो विश्वं समत्रिणं दह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rakṣasvinaḥ sadamid yātumāvato viśvaṃ samatriṇaṃ daha ||
Translation: Consume for ever all demons and sorcerers, consume thou each devouring fiend.

Sanskit Text: करीळं वः शर्धो मारुतमनर्वाणं रथेशुभम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: krīḷaṃ vaḥ śardho mārutamanarvāṇaṃ ratheśubham |
Translation: 1 SING forth, O Kaṇvas, to your band of Maruts unassailable,

Sanskit Text: कण्वा अभि पर गायत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaṇvā abhi pra ghāyata ||
Translation: Sporting, resplendent on their car

Sanskit Text: ये पर्षतीभिर्र्ष्टिभिः साकं वाशीभिरञ्जिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye pṛṣatībhirṛṣṭibhiḥ sākaṃ vāśībhirañjibhiḥ |
Translation: 2 They who, self-luminous, were born together, with the spotted deer,

Sanskit Text: अजायन्त सवभानवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajāyanta svabhānavaḥ ||
Translation: Spears, swords, and glittering ornaments.

Sanskit Text: इहेव शर्ण्व एषां कशा हस्तेषु यद वदान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iheva śṛṇva eṣāṃ kaśā hasteṣu yad vadān |
Translation: 3 One hears, as though ’twere close at hand, the cracking of the whips they hold

Sanskit Text: नि यामञ्चित्रं रञ्जते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni yāmañcitraṃ ṛñjate ||
Translation: They gather glory on their way.

Sanskit Text: पर वः शर्धाय घर्ष्वये तवेषद्युम्नाय शुष्मिणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vaḥ śardhāya ghṛṣvaye tveṣadyumnāya śuṣmiṇe |
Translation: 4 Now sing ye forth the God-given hymn to your exultant Marut host,

Sanskit Text: देवत्तं बरह्म गायत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devattaṃ brahma ghāyata ||
Translation: The fiercely-vigorous, the strong.

Sanskit Text: पर शंसा गोष्वघ्न्यं करीळं यच्छर्धो मारुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra śaṃsā ghoṣvaghnyaṃ krīḷaṃ yacchardho mārutam |
Translation: 5 Praise ye the Bull among the cows; for ’tis the Maruts’ sportive band:

Sanskit Text: जम्भे रसस्य वाव्र्धे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jambhe rasasya vāvṛdhe ||
Translation: It strengthened as it drank the rain.

Sanskit Text: को वो वर्षिष्ठ आ नरो दिवश्च गमश्च धूतयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko vo varṣiṣṭha ā naro divaśca ghmaśca dhūtayaḥ |
Translation: 6 Who is your mightiest, Heroes, when, O shakers of the earth and heaven,

Sanskit Text: यत सीम अन्तं न धूनुथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat sīm antaṃ na dhūnutha ||
Translation: Ye shake them like a garment's hem?

Sanskit Text: नि वो यामाय मानुषो दध्र उग्राय मन्यवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni vo yāmāya mānuṣo dadhra ughrāya manyave |
Translation: 7 At your approach man holds him down before the fury of your wrath:

Sanskit Text: जिहीत पर्वतो गिरिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jihīta parvato ghiriḥ ||
Translation: The rugged-jointed mountain yields.

Sanskit Text: येषाम अज्मेषु पर्थिवी जुजुर्वां इव विश्पतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yeṣām ajmeṣu pṛthivī jujurvāṃ iva viśpatiḥ |
Translation: 8 They at whose racings forth the earth, like an age-weakened lord of men,

Sanskit Text: भिया यामेषु रेजते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhiyā yāmeṣu rejate ||
Translation: Trembles in terror on their ways.

Sanskit Text: सथिरं हि जानम एषां वयो मातुर निरेतवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sthiraṃ hi jānam eṣāṃ vayo mātur niretave |
Translation: 9 Strong is their birth: vigour have they to issue from their Mother; strength,

Sanskit Text: यत सीम अनु दविता शवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat sīm anu dvitā śavaḥ ||
Translation: Yea, even twice enough, is theirs.

Sanskit Text: उद उ तये सूनवो गिरः काष्ठा अज्मेष्व अत्नत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud u tye sūnavo ghiraḥ kāṣṭhā ajmeṣv atnata |
Translation: 10 And these, the Sons, the Singers, in their racings have enlarged the bounds,

Sanskit Text: वाश्रा अभिज्ञु यातवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāśrā abhijñu yātave ||
Translation: So that the kine must walk knee-deep.

Sanskit Text: तयं चिद घा दीर्घम पर्थुम मिहो नपातम अम्र्ध्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tyaṃ cid ghā dīrgham pṛthum miho napātam amṛdhram |
Translation: 11 Before them, on the ways they go, they drop this offspring of the cloud,

Sanskit Text: पर चयावयन्ति यामभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra cyāvayanti yāmabhiḥ ||
Translation: Long, broad, and inexhaustible.

Sanskit Text: मरुतो यद ध वो बलं जनां अचुच्यवीतन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: maruto yad dha vo balaṃ janāṃ acucyavītana |
Translation: 12 O Maruts, as your strength is great, so have ye cast men down on earth,

Sanskit Text: गिरींर अचुच्यवीतन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghirīṃr acucyavītana ||
Translation: So have ye made the mountains fall.

Sanskit Text: यद ध यान्ति मरुतः सं ह बरुवते ऽधवन्न आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad dha yānti marutaḥ saṃ ha bruvate 'dhvann ā |
Translation: 13 The while the Maruts pass along, they talk together on the way:

Sanskit Text: शर्णोति कश चिद एषाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇoti kaś cid eṣām ||
Translation: Doth any hear them as they speak?

Sanskit Text: पर यात शीभम आशुभिः सन्ति कण्वेषु वो दुवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yāta śībham āśubhiḥ santi kaṇveṣu vo duvaḥ |
Translation: 14 Come quick with swift steeds, for ye have worshippers among Kaṇva's sons

Sanskit Text: तत्रो षु मादयाध्वै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tatro ṣu mādayādhvai ||
Translation: May you rejoice among them well.

Sanskit Text: अस्ति हि षमा मदाय वः समसि षमा वयम एषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asti hi ṣmā madāya vaḥ smasi ṣmā vayam eṣām |
Translation: 15 All is prepared for your delight. We are their servants evermore,

Sanskit Text: विश्वं चिद आयुर जीवसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvaṃ cid āyur jīvase ||
Translation: To live as long as life may last.

Sanskit Text: कद ध नूनं कधप्रियः पिता पुत्रं न हस्तयोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kad dha nūnaṃ kadhapriyaḥ pitā putraṃ na hastayoḥ |
Translation: 1 WHAT now? When will ye take us by both hands, as a dear sire his son,

Sanskit Text: दधिध्वे वर्क्तबर्हिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhidhve vṛktabarhiṣaḥ ||
Translation: Gods, for whom sacred grass is clipped?

Sanskit Text: कव नूनं कद वो अर्थं गन्ता दिवो न पर्थिव्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kva nūnaṃ kad vo arthaṃ ghantā divo na pṛthivyāḥ |
Translation: 2 Now whither? To what goal of yours go ye in heaven, and not on earth?

Sanskit Text: कव वो गावो न रण्यन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kva vo ghāvo na raṇyanti ||
Translation: Where do your cows disport themselves?

Sanskit Text: कव वः सुम्ना नव्यांसि मरुतः कव सुविता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kva vaḥ sumnā navyāṃsi marutaḥ kva suvitā |
Translation: 3 Where are your newest favours shown? Where, Maruts, your prosperity?

Sanskit Text: कव विश्वानि सौभगा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kv viśvāni saubhaghā ||
Translation: Where all your high felicities?

Sanskit Text: यद यूयम पर्श्निमातरो मर्तासः सयातन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad yūyam pṛśnimātaro martāsaḥ syātana |
Translation: 4 If, O ye Maruts, ye the Sons whom Pṛśni bore, were mortal, and

Sanskit Text: सतोता वो अम्र्तः सयात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stotā vo amṛtaḥ syāt ||
Translation: Immortal he who sings your praise.

Sanskit Text: मा वो मर्गो न यवसे जरिता भूद अजोष्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā vo mṛgho na yavase jaritā bhūd ajoṣyaḥ |
Translation: 5 Then never were your praiser loathed like a wild beast in pasture-land,

Sanskit Text: पथा यमस्य गाद उप ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pathā yamasya ghād upa ||
Translation: Nor should he go on Yama's path.

Sanskit Text: मो षु णः परा-परा निर्र्तिर दुर्हणा वधीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mo ṣu ṇaḥ parā-parā nirṛtir durhaṇā vadhīt |
Translation: 6 Let not destructive plague on plague hard to be conquered, strike its down:

Sanskit Text: पदीष्ट तर्ष्णया सह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: padīṣṭa tṛṣṇayā saha ||
Translation: Let each, with drought, depart from us.

Sanskit Text: सत्यं तवेषा अमवन्तो धन्वञ चिद आ रुद्रियासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satyaṃ tveṣā amavanto dhanvañ cid ā rudriyāsaḥ |
Translation: 7 Truly, they the fierce and mighty Sons of Rudra send their windless

Sanskit Text: मिहं कर्ण्वन्त्य अवाताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mihaṃ kṛṇvanty avātām ||
Translation: Rain e’en on the desert places.

Sanskit Text: वाश्रेव विद्युन मिमाति वत्सं न माता सिषक्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāśreva vidyun mimāti vatsaṃ na mātā siṣakti |
Translation: 8 Like a cow the lightning lows and follows, motherlike, her youngling,

Sanskit Text: यद एषां वर्ष्टिर असर्जि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad eṣāṃ vṛṣṭir asarji ||
Translation: When their rain-flood hath been loosened.

Sanskit Text: दिवा चित तमः कर्ण्वन्ति पर्जन्येनोदवाहेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divā cit tamaḥ kṛṇvanti parjanyenodavāhena |
Translation: 9 When they inundate the earth they spread forth darkness e’en in day time,

Sanskit Text: यत पर्थिवीं वयुन्दन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat pṛthivīṃ vyundanti ||
Translation: With the water-laden rain-cloud.

Sanskit Text: अध सवनान मरुतां विश्वम आ सद्म पार्थिवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha svanān marutāṃ viśvam ā sadma pārthivam |
Translation: 10 O Maruts, at your voice's sound this earthly habitation shakes,

Sanskit Text: अरेजन्त पर मानुषाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arejanta pra mānuṣāḥ ||
Translation: And each man reels who dwells therein.

Sanskit Text: मरुतो वीळुपाणिभिश चित्रा रोधस्वतीर अनु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: maruto vīḷupāṇibhiś citrā rodhasvatīr anu |
Translation: 11 O Maruts, with your strong-hoofed steeds, unhindered in their courses, haste

Sanskit Text: यातेम अखिद्रयामभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yātem akhidrayāmabhiḥ ||
Translation: Along the bright embanked streams.

Sanskit Text: सथिरा वः सन्तु नेमयो रथा अश्वास एषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sthirā vaḥ santu nemayo rathā aśvāsa eṣām |
Translation: 12 Firm be the fellies of your wheels, steady your horses and your cars,

Sanskit Text: सुसंस्क्र्ता अभीशवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: susaṃskṛtā abhīśavaḥ ||
Translation: And may your reins be fashioned well.

Sanskit Text: अछा वदा तना गिरा जरायै बरह्मणस पतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā vadā tanā ghirā jarāyai brahmaṇas patim |
Translation: 13 Invite thou hither with this song, for praise, Agni the Lord of Prayer,

Sanskit Text: अग्निम मित्रं न दर्शतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnim mitraṃ na darśatam ||
Translation: Him who is fair as Mitra is.

Sanskit Text: मिमीहि शलोकम आस्यपर्जन्य इव ततनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mimīhi ślokam āsyaparjanya iva tatanaḥ |
Translation: 14 Form in thy mouth the hymn of praise expand thee like, a rainy cloud

Sanskit Text: गाय गायत्रम उक्थ्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāya ghāyatram ukthyam ||
Translation: Sing forth the measured eulogy.

Sanskit Text: वन्दस्व मारुतं गणं तवेषम पनस्युम अर्किणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vandasva mārutaṃ ghaṇaṃ tveṣam panasyum arkiṇam |
Translation: 15 Sing glory to the Marut host, praiseworthy, tuneful, vigorous:

Sanskit Text: अस्मे वर्द्धा असन्न इह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme vṛddhā asann iha ||
Translation: Here let the Strong Ones dwell with us.

Sanskit Text: पर यद इत्था परावतः शोचिर न मानम अस्यथ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yad itthā parāvataḥ śocir na mānam asyatha |
Translation: 1 WHEN thus, like flame, from far away, Maruts, ye cast your measure forth,

Sanskit Text: कस्य करत्वा मरुतः कस्य वर्पसा कं याथ कं ह धूतयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kasya kratvā marutaḥ kasya varpasā kaṃ yātha kaṃ ha dhūtayaḥ ||
Translation: To whom go Ye, to whom, O shakers of the earth, moved by whose wisdom, whose design?

Sanskit Text: सथिरा वः सन्त्व आयुधा पराणुदे वीळू उत परतिष्कभे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sthirā vaḥ santv āyudhā parāṇude vīḷū uta pratiṣkabhe |
Translation: 2 Strong let your weapons be to drive away your foes, firm for resistance let them be.

Sanskit Text: युष्माकम अस्तु तविषी पनीयसी मा मर्त्यस्य मायिनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmākam astu taviṣī panīyasī mā martyasya māyinaḥ ||
Translation: Yea, passing glorious must be your warrior might, not as a guileful mortal's strength.

Sanskit Text: परा ह यत सथिरं हथ नरो वर्तयथा गुरु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parā ha yat sthiraṃ hatha naro vartayathā ghuru |
Translation: 3 When what is strong ye overthrow, and whirl about each ponderous thing,

Sanskit Text: वि याथन वनिनः पर्थिव्या वय आशाः पर्वतानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yāthana vaninaḥ pṛthivyā vy āśāḥ parvatānām ||
Translation: Heroes, your course is through the forest trees of earth, and through the fissures of the rocks.

Sanskit Text: नहि वः शत्रुर विविदे अधि दयवि न भूम्यां रिशादसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi vaḥ śatrur vivide adhi dyavi na bhūmyāṃ riśādasaḥ |
Translation: 4 Consumers of your foes, no enemy of yours is found in heaven or on the earth:

Sanskit Text: युष्माकम अस्तु तविषी तना युजा रुद्रासो नू चिद आध्र्षे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmākam astu taviṣī tanā yujā rudrāso nū cid ādhṛṣe ||
Translation: Ye Rudras, may the strength, held in this bond, be yours, to bid defiance even now.

Sanskit Text: पर वेपयन्ति पर्वतान वि विञ्चन्ति वनस्पतीन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vepayanti parvatān vi viñcanti vanaspatīn |
Translation: 5 They make the mountains rock and reel, they rend the forest-kings apart.

Sanskit Text: परो आरत मरुतो दुर्मदा इव देवासः सर्वया विशा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pro ārata maruto durmadā iva devāsaḥ sarvayā viśā ||
Translation: Onward, ye Maruts, drive, like creatures drunk with wine, ye, Gods with all your company.

Sanskit Text: उपो रथेषु पर्षतीर अयुग्ध्वम परष्टिर वहति रोहितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upo ratheṣu pṛṣatīr ayughdhvam praṣṭir vahati rohitaḥ |
Translation: 6 Ye to your chariot have yoked the spotted deer: a red deer, as a leader, draws.

Sanskit Text: आ वो यामाय पर्थिवी चिद अश्रोद अबीभयन्त मानुषाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vo yāmāya pṛthivī cid aśrod abībhayanta mānuṣāḥ ||
Translation: Even the Earth herself listened as ye came near, and men were sorely terrified.

Sanskit Text: आ वो मक्षू तनाय कं रुद्रा अवो वर्णीमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vo makṣū tanāya kaṃ rudrā avo vṛṇīmahe |
Translation: 7 O Rudras, quickly we desire your succour for this work of ours.

Sanskit Text: गन्ता नूनं नो ऽवसा यथा पुरेत्था कण्वाय बिभ्युषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghantā nūnaṃ no 'vasā yathā puretthā kaṇvāya bibhyuṣe ||
Translation: Come to us with your aid as in the days of old, so now for frightened Kaṇva's sake.

Sanskit Text: युष्मेषितो मरुतो मर्त्येषित आ यो नो अभ्व ईषते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmeṣito maruto martyeṣita ā yo no abhva īṣate |
Translation: 8 Should any monstrous foe, O Maruts, sent by you or sent by mortals threaten us,

Sanskit Text: वि तं युयोत शवसा वय ओजसा वि युष्माकाभिर ऊतिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi taṃ yuyota śavasā vy ojasā vi yuṣmākābhir ūtibhiḥ ||
Translation: Tear ye him from us with your power and with your might, and with the succours that are yours.

Sanskit Text: असामि हि परयज्यवः कण्वं दद परचेतसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asāmi hi prayajyavaḥ kaṇvaṃ dada pracetasaḥ |
Translation: 9 For ye, the worshipful and wise, have guarded Kaṇva perfectly.

Sanskit Text: असामिभिर्मरुत आ न ऊतिभिर्गन्ता वर्ष्तिं न विद्युतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asāmibhirmaruta ā na ūtibhirghantā vṛṣtiṃ na vidyutaḥ ||
Translation: O Maruts, come to us with full protecting help, as lightning flashes seek the rain.

Sanskit Text: असाम्योजो बिभ्र्था सुदानवो.असामि धूतयः शवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asāmyojo bibhṛthā sudānavo.asāmi dhūtayaḥ śavaḥ |
Translation: 10 Whole strength have ye, O Bounteous Ones; perfect, earth-shakers, is your might.

Sanskit Text: रषिद्विषे मरुतः परिमन्यव इषुं न सर्जत दविषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṣidviṣe marutaḥ parimanyava iṣuṃ na sṛjata dviṣam ||
Translation: Maruts, against the poet's wrathful enemy send ye an enemy like a dart.

Sanskit Text: उत तिष्ठ बरह्मणस पते देवयन्तस्त्वेमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut tiṣṭha brahmaṇas pate devayantastvemahe |
Translation: 1 O BRAHMAṆASPATI, stand up: God-serving men we pray to thee.

Sanskit Text: उप पर यन्तु मरुतः सुदानव इन्द्र पराशूर्भवा सचा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa pra yantu marutaḥ sudānava indra prāśūrbhavā sacā ||
Translation: May they who give good gifts, the Maruts, come to us. Indra, most swift, be thou with them.

Sanskit Text: तवामिद धि सहसस पुत्र मर्त्य उपब्रूते धने हिते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmid dhi sahasas putra martya upabrūte dhane hite |
Translation: 2 O Son of Strength, each mortal calls to thee for aid when spoil of battle waits for him.

Sanskit Text: सुवीर्यं मरुत आ सवश्व्यं दधीत यो व आचके ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvīryaṃ maruta ā svaśvyaṃ dadhīta yo va ācake ||
Translation: O Maruts, may this man who loves you well obtain wealth of good steeds and hero might.

Sanskit Text: परैतु बरह्मणस पतिः पर देव्येतु सून्र्ता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: praitu brahmaṇas patiḥ pra devyetu sūnṛtā |
Translation: 3 May Brahmaṇaspati draw nigh, may Sūnṛtā the Goddess come,

Sanskit Text: अछा वीरंनर्यं पङकतिराधसं देवा यज्ञं नयन्तु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā vīraṃnaryaṃ paṅktirādhasaṃ devā yajñaṃ nayantu naḥ ||
Translation: And Gods bring to this rite which gives the five-fold gift the Hero, lover of mankind.

Sanskit Text: यो वाघते ददाति सूनरं वसु स धत्ते अक्षिति शरवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vāghate dadāti sūnaraṃ vasu sa dhatte akṣiti śravaḥ |
Translation: 4 He who bestows a noble guerdon on the priest wins fame that never shall decay.

Sanskit Text: तस्मा इळां सुवीरामा यजामहे सुप्रतूर्तिमनेहसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmā iḷāṃ suvīrāmā yajāmahe supratūrtimanehasam ||
Translation: For him we offer sacred hero-giving food, peerless and conquering easily.

Sanskit Text: पर नूनं बरह्मणस पतिर्मन्त्रं वदत्युक्थ्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra nūnaṃ brahmaṇas patirmantraṃ vadatyukthyam |
Translation: 5 Now Brahmaṇaspati speaks forth aloud the solemn hymn of praise,

Sanskit Text: यस्मिन्निन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा देवा ओकांसि चक्रिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasminnindro varuṇo mitro aryamā devā okāṃsi cakrire ||
Translation: Wherein Indra and Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, the Gods, have made their dwelling place.

Sanskit Text: तमिद वोचेमा विदथेषु शम्भुवं मन्त्रं देवा अनेहसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamid vocemā vidatheṣu śambhuvaṃ mantraṃ devā anehasam |
Translation: 6 May we in holy synods, Gods! recite that hymn, peerless, that brings felicity.

Sanskit Text: इमां च वाचं परतिहर्यथा नरो विश्वेद वामा वो अश्नवत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imāṃ ca vācaṃ pratiharyathā naro viśved vāmā vo aśnavat ||
Translation: If you, O Heroes, graciously accept this word, may it obtain all bliss from you.

Sanskit Text: को देवयन्तमश्नवज्जनं को वर्क्तबर्हिषम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko devayantamaśnavajjanaṃ ko vṛktabarhiṣam |
Translation: 7 Who shall approach the pious? who the man whose sacred grass is trimmed?

Sanskit Text: पर-पर दाश्वान पस्त्याभिरस्थितान्तर्वावत कषयं दधे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra-pra dāśvān pastyābhirasthitāntarvāvat kṣayaṃ dadhe ||
Translation: The offerer with his folk advances more and more: he fills his house with precious things.

Sanskit Text: उप कष्स्त्रं पर्ञ्चीत हन्ति राजभिर्भये चित सुक्षितिं दधे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa kṣstraṃ pṛñcīta hanti rājabhirbhaye cit sukṣitiṃ dadhe |
Translation: 8 He amplifies his lordly might, with kings he slays: e’en mid alarms he dwells secure

Sanskit Text: नास्य वर्ता न तरुता महाधने नार्भे अस्ति वज्रिणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāsya vartā na tarutā mahādhane nārbhe asti vajriṇaḥ ||
Translation: In great or lesser fight none checks him, none subdues,—the wielder of the thunderbolt.

Sanskit Text: यं रक्षन्ति परचेतसो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ rakṣanti pracetaso varuṇo mitro aryamā |
Translation: 1 NE’ER is he injured whom the Gods Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman,

Sanskit Text: नू चित स दभ्यते जनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū cit sa dabhyate janaḥ ||
Translation: The excellently wise, protect.

Sanskit Text: यं बाहुतेव पिप्रति पान्ति मर्त्यं रिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ bāhuteva piprati pānti martyaṃ riṣaḥ |
Translation: 2 He prospers ever, free from scathe, whom they, as with full hands, enrich,

Sanskit Text: अरिष्टः सर्व एधते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ariṣṭaḥ sarva edhate ||
Translation: Whom they preserve from every foe.

Sanskit Text: वि दुर्गा वि दविषः पुरो घनन्ति राजान एषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi durghā vi dviṣaḥ puro ghnanti rājāna eṣām |
Translation: 3 The Kings drive far away from him his troubles and his enemies,

Sanskit Text: नयन्ति दुरिता तिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nayanti duritā tiraḥ ||
Translation: And lead him safely o’er distress.

Sanskit Text: सुगः पन्था अन्र्क्षर आदित्यास रतं यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sughaḥ panthā anṛkṣara ādityāsa ṛtaṃ yate |
Translation: 4 Thornless, Ādityas, is the path, easy for him who seeks the Law:

Sanskit Text: नात्रावखादो अस्ति वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nātrāvakhādo asti vaḥ ||
Translation: With him is naught to anger you.

Sanskit Text: यं यज्ञं नयथा नर आदित्या रजुना पथा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ yajñaṃ nayathā nara ādityā ṛjunā pathā |
Translation: 5 What sacrifice, Ādityas, ye Heroes guide by the path direct,—

Sanskit Text: पर वः स धीतये नशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vaḥ sa dhītaye naśat ||
Translation: May that come nigh unto your thought.

Sanskit Text: स रत्नं मर्त्यो वसु विश्वं तोकमुत तमना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ratnaṃ martyo vasu viśvaṃ tokamuta tmanā |
Translation: 6 That mortal, ever unsubdued, gains wealth and every precious thing,

Sanskit Text: अछा गछत्यस्त्र्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā ghachatyastṛtaḥ ||
Translation: And children also of his own.

Sanskit Text: कथा राधाम सखायः सतोमं मित्रस्यार्यम्णः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kathā rādhāma sakhāyaḥ stomaṃ mitrasyāryamṇaḥ |
Translation: 7 How, my friends, shall we prepare Aryaman's and Mitra's laud,

Sanskit Text: महि पसरो वरुणस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahi psaro varuṇasya ||
Translation: Glorious food of Varuṇa?

Sanskit Text: मा वो घनन्तं मा शपन्तं परति वोचे देवयन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā vo ghnantaṃ mā śapantaṃ prati voce devayantam |
Translation: 8 I point not out to you a man who strikes the pious, or reviles:

Sanskit Text: सुम्नैरिद व आ विवासे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sumnairid va ā vivāse ||
Translation: Only with hymns I call you nigh.

Sanskit Text: चतुरश्चिद ददमानाद बिभीयादा निधातोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: caturaścid dadamānād bibhīyādā nidhātoḥ |
Translation: 9 Let him not love to speak ill words: but fear the One who holds all four

Sanskit Text: न दुरुक्ताय सप्र्हयेत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na duruktāya spṛhayet ||
Translation: Within his hand, until they fall.

Sanskit Text: सं पूषन्नध्वनस्तिर वयंहो विमुचो नपात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ pūṣannadhvanastira vyaṃho vimuco napāt |
Translation: 1 SHORTEN our ways, O Pūṣan, move aside obstruction in the path:

Sanskit Text: सक्ष्वा देवप्र णस पुरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakṣvā devapra ṇas puraḥ ||
Translation: Go close before us, cloud-born God.

Sanskit Text: यो नः पूषन्नघो वर्को दुःशेव आदिदेशति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo naḥ pūṣannagho vṛko duḥśeva ādideśati |
Translation: 2 Drive, Pūṣan, from our road the wolf, the wicked inauspicious wolf,

Sanskit Text: अप सम तम्पथो जहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa sma tampatho jahi ||
Translation: Who lies in wait to injure us.

Sanskit Text: अप तयं परिपन्थिनं मुषीवाणं हुरश्चितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa tyaṃ paripanthinaṃ muṣīvāṇaṃ huraścitam |
Translation: 3 Who lurks about the path we take, the robber with a guileful heart:

Sanskit Text: दूरमधिस्रुतेरज ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūramadhisruteraja ||
Translation: Far from the road chase him away.

Sanskit Text: तवं तस्य दवयाविनो.अघशंसस्य कस्य चित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tasya dvayāvino.aghaśaṃsasya kasya cit |
Translation: 4 Tread with thy foot and trample out the firebrand of the wicked one,

Sanskit Text: पदाभि तिष्ठ तपुषिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: padābhi tiṣṭha tapuṣim ||
Translation: The double-tongued, whoe’er he be.

Sanskit Text: आ तत ते दस्र मन्तुमः पूषन्नवो वर्णीमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tat te dasra mantumaḥ pūṣannavo vṛṇīmahe |
Translation: 5 Wise Pūṣan, Wonder-Worker, we claim of thee now the aid wherewith

Sanskit Text: येन पितॄनचोदयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena pitṝnacodayaḥ ||
Translation: Thou furtheredst our sires of old.

Sanskit Text: अधा नो विश्वसौभग हिरण्यवाशीमत्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā no viśvasaubhagha hiraṇyavāśīmattama |
Translation: 6 So, Lord of all prosperity, best wielder of the golden sword,

Sanskit Text: धनानि सुषणा कर्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhanāni suṣaṇā kṛdhi ||
Translation: Make riches easy to be won.

Sanskit Text: अति नः सश्चतो नय सुगा नः सुपथा कर्णु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ati naḥ saścato naya sughā naḥ supathā kṛṇu |
Translation: 7 Past all pursuers lead us, make pleasant our path and fair to tread:

Sanskit Text: पूषन्निहक्रतुं विदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūṣannihakratuṃ vidaḥ ||
Translation: O Pūṣan, find thou power for this.

Sanskit Text: अभि सूयवसं नय न नवज्वारो अध्वने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi sūyavasaṃ naya na navajvāro adhvane |
Translation: 8 Lead us to meadows rich in grass: send on our way no early heat:
O Pūṣan, find thou power for this.

Sanskit Text: शग्धि पूर्धि पर यंसि च शिशीहि परास्युदरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaghdhi pūrdhi pra yaṃsi ca śiśīhi prāsyudaram |
Translation: 9 Be gracious to us, fill us full, give, feed us, and invigorate:
O Pūṣan, find thou power for this.

Sanskit Text: न पूषणं मेथामसि सूक्तैरभि गर्णीमसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na pūṣaṇaṃ methāmasi sūktairabhi ghṛṇīmasi |
Translation: 10 No blame have we for Pūṣan; him we magnify with songs of praise:

Sanskit Text: वसूनि दस्ममीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasūni dasmamīmahe ||
Translation: We seek the Mighty One for wealth.

Sanskit Text: कद रुद्राय परचेतसे मीळ्हुष्टमाय तव्यसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kad rudrāya pracetase mīḷhuṣṭamāya tavyase |
Translation: 1 WHAT shall we sing to Rudra, strong, most bounteous, excellently wise,

Sanskit Text: वोचेम शन्तमं हर्दे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vocema śantamaṃ hṛde ||
Translation: That shall be dearest to his heart?

Sanskit Text: यथा नो अदितिः करत पश्वे नर्भ्यो यथा गवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā no aditiḥ karat paśve nṛbhyo yathā ghave |
Translation: 2 That Aditi may grant the grace of Rudra to our folk, our kine,

Sanskit Text: यथा तोकाय रुद्रियम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā tokāya rudriyam ||
Translation: Our cattle and our progeny;

Sanskit Text: यथा नो मित्रो वरुणो यथा रुद्रश्चिकेतति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā no mitro varuṇo yathā rudraściketati |
Translation: 3 That Mitra and that Varuṇa, that Rudra may remember us,

Sanskit Text: यथा विश्वे सजोषसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā viśve sajoṣasaḥ ||
Translation: Yea, all the Gods with one accord.

Sanskit Text: गाथपतिं मेधपतिं रुद्रं जलाषभेषजम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāthapatiṃ medhapatiṃ rudraṃ jalāṣabheṣajam |
Translation: 4 To Rudra Lord of sacrifice, of hymns and balmy medicines,

Sanskit Text: तच्छंयोः सुम्नमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tacchaṃyoḥ sumnamīmahe ||
Translation: We pray for joy and health and strength.

Sanskit Text: यः शुक्र इव सूर्यो हिरण्यमिव रोचते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ śukra iva sūryo hiraṇyamiva rocate |
Translation: 5 He shines in splendour like the Sun, refulgent as bright gold is he,

Sanskit Text: शरेष्ठो देवानां वसुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śreṣṭho devānāṃ vasuḥ ||
Translation: The good, the best among the Gods.

Sanskit Text: शं नः करत्यर्वते सुगं मेषाय मेष्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ naḥ karatyarvate sughaṃ meṣāya meṣye |
Translation: 6 May he grant health into our steeds, wellbeing to our rams and ewes,

Sanskit Text: नर्भ्यो नारिभ्यो गवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛbhyo nāribhyo ghave ||
Translation: To men, to women, and to kine.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे सोम शरियमधि नि धेहि शतस्य नर्णाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme soma śriyamadhi ni dhehi śatasya nṛṇām |
Translation: 7 O Soma, set thou upon us the glory of a hundred men,

Sanskit Text: महि शरवस्तुविन्र्म्णम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahi śravastuvinṛmṇam ||
Translation: The great renown of mighty chiefs.

Sanskit Text: मा नः सोमपरिबाधो मारातयो जुहुरन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā naḥ somaparibādho mārātayo juhuranta |
Translation: 8 Let not malignities, nor those who trouble Soma, hinder us.

Sanskit Text: आ न इन्दो वाजे भज ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā na indo vāje bhaja ||
Translation: Indu, give us a share of strength.

Sanskit Text: यास्ते परजा अम्र्तस्य परस्मिन धामन्न्र्तस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāste prajā amṛtasya parasmin dhāmannṛtasya |
Translation: 9 Soma! head, central point, love these; Soma! know these as serving thee,

Sanskit Text: मूर्धा नाभा सोम वेन आभूषन्तीः सोम वेदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mūrdhā nābhā soma vena ābhūṣantīḥ soma vedaḥ ||
Translation: Children of thee Immortal, at the highest place of holy law.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने विवस्वदुषसश्चित्रं राधो अमर्त्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne vivasvaduṣasaścitraṃ rādho amartya |
Translation: 1 IMMORTAL Jātavedas, thou many-hued fulgent gift of Dawn,

Sanskit Text: आ दाशुषे जातवेदो वहा तवमद्या देवानुषर्बुधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā dāśuṣe jātavedo vahā tvamadyā devānuṣarbudhaḥ ||
Translation: Agni, this day to him who pays oblations bring the Gods who waken with the morn.

Sanskit Text: जुष्टो हि दूतो असि हव्यवाहनो.अग्ने रथीरध्वराणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣṭo hi dūto asi havyavāhano.aghne rathīradhvarāṇām |
Translation: 2 For thou art offering-bearer and loved messenger, the charioteer of sacrifice:

Sanskit Text: सजूरश्विभ्यामुषसा सुवीर्यमस्मे धेहि शरवो बर्हत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajūraśvibhyāmuṣasā suvīryamasme dhehi śravo bṛhat ||
Translation: Accordant with the Aśvins and with Dawn grant us heroic strength and lofty fame.

Sanskit Text: अद्या दूतं वर्णीमहे वसुमग्निं पुरुप्रियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adyā dūtaṃ vṛṇīmahe vasumaghniṃ purupriyam |
Translation: 3 As messenger we choose to-day Agni the good whom many love,

Sanskit Text: धूमकेतुं भार्जीकं वयुष्टिषु यज्ञानामध्वरश्रियम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhūmaketuṃ bhāṛjīkaṃ vyuṣṭiṣu yajñānāmadhvaraśriyam ||
Translation: Smoke-bannered spreader of the light, at break of day glory of sacrificial rites.

Sanskit Text: शरेष्ठं यविष्ठमतिथिं सवाहुतं जुष्टं जनाय दाशुषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śreṣṭhaṃ yaviṣṭhamatithiṃ svāhutaṃ juṣṭaṃ janāya dāśuṣe |
Translation: 4 Him noblest and most youthful, richly worshipped guest, dear to the men who offer gifts,

Sanskit Text: देवानछा यातवे जातवेदसमग्निमीळे वयुष्टिषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānachā yātave jātavedasamaghnimīḷe vyuṣṭiṣu ||
Translation: Him, Agni Jātavedas, I beseech at dawn that he may bring the Gods to us.

Sanskit Text: सतविष्यामि तवामहं विश्वस्याम्र्त भोजन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: staviṣyāmi tvāmahaṃ viśvasyāmṛta bhojana |
Translation: 5 Thee, Agni, will I glorify, deathless nourisher of the world,

Sanskit Text: अग्ने तरातारमम्र्तं मियेध्य यजिष्ठं हव्यवाहन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne trātāramamṛtaṃ miyedhya yajiṣṭhaṃ havyavāhana ||
Translation: Immortal, offering-bearer, meet for sacred food, preserver, best at sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: सुशंसो बोधि गर्णते यविष्ठ्य मधुजिह्वः सवाहुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suśaṃso bodhi ghṛṇate yaviṣṭhya madhujihvaḥ svāhutaḥ |
Translation: 6 Tell good things to thy praiser, O most youthful God, as richly worshipped, honey-tongued,

Sanskit Text: परस्कण्वस्य परतिरन्नायुर्जीवसे नमस्या दैव्यं जनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: praskaṇvasya pratirannāyurjīvase namasyā daivyaṃ janam ||
Translation: And, granting to Praskaṇva lengthened days of life, show honour to the Heavenly Host.

Sanskit Text: होतारं विश्ववेदसं सं हि तवा विश इन्धते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotāraṃ viśvavedasaṃ saṃ hi tvā viśa indhate |
Translation: 7 For the men, Agni, kindle thee as all possessor and as Priest;

Sanskit Text: स आ वह पुरुहूत परचेतसो.अग्ने देवानिह दरवत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ā vaha puruhūta pracetaso.aghne devāniha dravat ||
Translation: So Agni, much-invoked, bring hither with all speed the Gods, the excellently wise,

Sanskit Text: सवितारमुषसमश्विना भगमग्निं वयुष्टिषु कषपः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: savitāramuṣasamaśvinā bhaghamaghniṃ vyuṣṭiṣu kṣapaḥ |
Translation: 8 At dawn of day, at night, Uṣas and Savitar, the Aśvins, Bhaga, Agni's self:

Sanskit Text: कण्वासस्त्वा सुतसोमास इन्धते हव्यवाहं सवध्वर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaṇvāsastvā sutasomāsa indhate havyavāhaṃ svadhvara ||
Translation: Skilled in fair rites, with Soma poured, the Kaṇvas light thee, the oblation-wafting God.

Sanskit Text: पतिर हि अध्वराणाम अग्ने दूतो विशाम असि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: patir hi adhvarāṇām aghne dūto viśām asi |
Translation: 9 For, Agni, Lord of sacrifice and messenger of men art thou:

Sanskit Text: उषर्बुध आवह सोमपीतये देवानद्य सवर्द्र्शः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣarbudha āvaha somapītaye devānadya svardṛśaḥ ||
Translation: Bring thou the Gods who wake at dawn who see the light, this day to drink the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने पूर्वा अनूषसो विभावसो दीदेथ विश्वदर्षतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne pūrvā anūṣaso vibhāvaso dīdetha viśvadarṣataḥ |
Translation: 10 Thou shonest forth, O Agni, after former dawns, all visible, O rich in light.

Sanskit Text: असि गरामेष्वविता पुरोहितो.असि यज्ञेषु मानुषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asi ghrāmeṣvavitā purohito.asi yajñeṣu mānuṣaḥ ||
Translation: Thou art our help in battle-strife, the Friend of man, the great high priest in sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: नि तवा यज्ञस्य साधनमग्ने होतारं रत्विजम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni tvā yajñasya sādhanamaghne hotāraṃ ṛtvijam |
Translation: 11 Like Manu, we will stablish thee, Agni, performer of the rite,

Sanskit Text: मनुष्वद देव धीमहि परचेतसं जीरं दूतममर्त्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manuṣvad deva dhīmahi pracetasaṃ jīraṃ dūtamamartyam ||
Translation: Invoker, ministering Priest, exceeding wise, the swift immortal messenger.

Sanskit Text: यद देवानां मित्रमहः पुरोहितो.अन्तरो यासि दूत्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad devānāṃ mitramahaḥ purohito.antaro yāsi dūtyam |
Translation: 12 When as the Gods’ High Priest, by many loved, thou dost their mission as their nearest Friend,

Sanskit Text: सिन्धोरिव परस्वनितास ऊर्मयो.अग्नेर्भ्राजन्ते अर्चयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sindhoriva prasvanitāsa ūrmayo.aghnerbhrājante arcayaḥ ||
Translation: Then, like the far-resounding billows of the flood, thy flames, O Agni, roar aloud.

Sanskit Text: शरुधि शरुत्कर्ण वह्निभिर्देवैरग्ने सयावभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrudhi śrutkarṇa vahnibhirdevairaghne sayāvabhiḥ |
Translation: 13 Hear, Agni, who hast ears to hear, with all thy train of escort Gods;

Sanskit Text: आ सीदन्तु बर्हिषि मित्रो अर्यमा परातर्यावाणो अध्वरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā sīdantu barhiṣi mitro aryamā prātaryāvāṇo adhvaram ||
Translation: Let Mitra, Aryaman, seeking betimes our rite, seat them upon the sacred grass.

Sanskit Text: शर्ण्वन्तु सतोमं मरुतः सुदानवो.अग्निजिह्वा रताव्र्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇvantu stomaṃ marutaḥ sudānavo.aghnijihvā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ |
Translation: 14 Let those who strengthen Law, who bountifully give, the life-tongued Maruts, hear our praise.

Sanskit Text: पिबतु सोमं वरुणो धर्तव्रतो.अश्विभ्यामुषसा सजूः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibatu somaṃ varuṇo dhṛtavrato.aśvibhyāmuṣasā sajūḥ ||
Translation: May Law-supporting Varuṇa with the Aśvins twain and Uṣas, drink the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने वसून्रिह रुद्रानादित्यानुत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne vasūnriha rudrānādityānuta |
Translation: 1 WORSHIP the Vasus, Agni! here, the Rudras, the Ādityas, all

Sanskit Text: यजा सवध्वरं जनं मनुजातं घर्तप्रुषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajā svadhvaraṃ janaṃ manujātaṃ ghṛtapruṣam ||
Translation: Who spring from Manu, those who know fair rites, who pour their blessings down.

Sanskit Text: शरुष्टीवानो हि दाशुषे देवा अग्ने विचेतसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śruṣṭīvāno hi dāśuṣe devā aghne vicetasaḥ |
Translation: 2 Agni, the Gods who understand give ear unto the worshipper:

Sanskit Text: तान रोहिदश्व गिर्वणस्त्रयस्त्रिंशतमा वह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tān rohidaśva ghirvaṇastrayastriṃśatamā vaha ||
Translation: Lord of Red Steeds, who lovest song, bring thou those Three-and-Thirty Gods.

Sanskit Text: परियमेधवदत्रिवज्जातवेदो विरूपवत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyamedhavadatrivajjātavedo virūpavat |
Translation: 3 O Jātavedas, great in act, hearken thou to Praskaṇva's call,

Sanskit Text: अङगिरस्वन महिव्रत परस्कण्वस्य शरुधी हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṅghirasvan mahivrata praskaṇvasya śrudhī havam ||
Translation: As Priyamedha erst was heard, Atri, Virūpa, Aṅgiras.

Sanskit Text: महिकेरव ऊतये परियमेधा अहूषत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahikerava ūtaye priyamedhā ahūṣata |
Translation: 4 The sons of Priyamedha skilled in lofty praise have called for help

Sanskit Text: राजन्तमध्वराणामग्निं शुक्रेण शोचिषा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājantamadhvarāṇāmaghniṃ śukreṇa śociṣā ||
Translation: On Agni who with fulgent flame is Ruler of all holy rites.

Sanskit Text: घर्ताहवन सन्त्येमा उ षु शरुधी गिरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtāhavana santyemā u ṣu śrudhī ghiraḥ |
Translation: 5 Hear thou, invoked with holy oil, bountiful giver of rewards,

Sanskit Text: याभिः कण्वस्य सूनवो हवन्ते.अवसे तवा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ kaṇvasya sūnavo havante.avase tvā ||
Translation: These eulogies, whereby the sons of Kaṇva call thee to their aid.

Sanskit Text: तवां चित्रश्रवस्तम हवन्ते विक्षु जन्तवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ citraśravastama havante vikṣu jantavaḥ |
Translation: 6 O Agni, loved by many, thou of fame most wondrous, in their homes

Sanskit Text: शोचिष्केशम्पुरुप्रियाग्ने हव्याय वोळ्हवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śociṣkeśampurupriyāghne havyāya voḷhave ||
Translation: Men call on thee whose hair is flame, to be the bearer of their gifts.

Sanskit Text: नि तवा होतारं रत्विजं दधिरे वसुवित्तमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni tvā hotāraṃ ṛtvijaṃ dadhire vasuvittamam |
Translation: 7 Thee, Agni, best to find out wealth, most widely famous, quick to hear,

Sanskit Text: शरुत्कर्णं सप्रथस्तमं विप्रा अग्ने दिविष्टिषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrutkarṇaṃ saprathastamaṃ viprā aghne diviṣṭiṣu ||
Translation: Singers have stablished in their rites Herald and ministering Priest.

Sanskit Text: आ तवा विप्रा अचुच्यवुः सुतसोमा अभि परयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tvā viprā acucyavuḥ sutasomā abhi prayaḥ |
Translation: 8 Singers with Soma pressed have made thee, Agni, hasten to the feast,

Sanskit Text: बर्हद भा बिभ्रतो हविरग्ने मर्ताय दाशुषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhad bhā bibhrato haviraghne martāya dāśuṣe ||
Translation: Great light to mortal worshipper, what time they bring the sacred gift.

Sanskit Text: परातर्याव्णः सहस्क्र्त सोमपेयाय सन्त्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātaryāvṇaḥ sahaskṛta somapeyāya santya |
Translation: 9 Good, bounteous, Son of Strength, this day seat here on sacred grass the Gods

Sanskit Text: इहाद्य दैव्यंजनं बर्हिरा सादया वसो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ihādya daivyaṃjanaṃ barhirā sādayā vaso ||
Translation: Who come at early morn, the host of heaven, to drink the Soma juice

Sanskit Text: अर्वाञ्चं दैव्यं जनमग्ने यक्ष्व सहूतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāñcaṃ daivyaṃ janamaghne yakṣva sahūtibhiḥ |
Translation: 10 Bring with joint invocations thou, O Agni, the celestial host:

Sanskit Text: अयं सोमः सुदानवस्तं पात तिरोह्न्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ somaḥ sudānavastaṃ pāta tiroahnyam ||
Translation: Here stands the Soma, bounteous Gods drink this expressed ere yesterday.

Sanskit Text: एषो उषा अपूर्व्य वयुछति परिया दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣo uṣā apūrvya vyuchati priyā divaḥ |
Translation: 1 Now Morning with her earliest light shines forth, dear Daughter of the Sky:

Sanskit Text: सतुषे वामश्विना बर्हत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stuṣe vāmaśvinā bṛhat ||
Translation: High, Aśvins, I extol your praise,

Sanskit Text: या दस्रा सिन्धुमातरा मनोतरा रयीणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā dasrā sindhumātarā manotarā rayīṇām |
Translation: 2 Sons of the Sea, mighty to save discoverers of riches, ye

Sanskit Text: धिया देवा वसुविदा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiyā devā vasuvidā ||
Translation: Gods with deep thought who find out wealth.

Sanskit Text: वच्यन्ते वां ककुहासो जूर्णायामधि विष्टपि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vacyante vāṃ kakuhāso jūrṇāyāmadhi viṣṭapi |
Translation: 3 Your giant coursers hasten on over the region all in flames,

Sanskit Text: यद वांरथो विभिष पतात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vāṃratho vibhiṣ patāt ||
Translation: When your car flies with winged steeds.

Sanskit Text: हविषा जारो अपां पिपर्ति पपुरिर्नरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: haviṣā jāro apāṃ piparti papurirnarā |
Translation: 4 He, liberal, lover of the flood, Lord of the House, the vigilant,

Sanskit Text: पिता कुटस्य चर्षणिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pitā kuṭasya carṣaṇiḥ ||
Translation: Chiefs! with oblations feeds you full.

Sanskit Text: आदारो वां मतीनां नासत्या मतवचसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādāro vāṃ matīnāṃ nāsatyā matavacasā |
Translation: 5 Ye have regard unto our hymns, Nāsatyas, thinking of our words:

Sanskit Text: पातं सोमस्य धर्ष्णुया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pātaṃ somasya dhṛṣṇuyā ||
Translation: Drink boldly of the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: या नः पीपरदश्विना जयोतिष्मती तमस्तिरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā naḥ pīparadaśvinā jyotiṣmatī tamastiraḥ |
Translation: 6 Vouchsafe to us, O Aśvin Pair, such strength as, with attendant light,

Sanskit Text: तामस्मे रासाथामिषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāmasme rāsāthāmiṣam ||
Translation: May through the darkness carry us.

Sanskit Text: आ नो नावा मतीनां यातं पाराय गन्तवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no nāvā matīnāṃ yātaṃ pārāya ghantave |
Translation: 7 Come in the ship of these our hymns to bear you to the hither shore

Sanskit Text: युञ्जाथामश्विना रथम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuñjāthāmaśvinā ratham ||
Translation: O Aśvins, harness ye the car.

Sanskit Text: अरित्रं वां दिवस पर्थु तीर्थे सिन्धूनां रथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aritraṃ vāṃ divas pṛthu tīrthe sindhūnāṃ rathaḥ |
Translation: 8 The heaven's wide vessel is your own on the flood's shore your chariot waits

Sanskit Text: धिया युयुज्र इन्दवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiyā yuyujra indavaḥ ||
Translation: Drops, with the hymn, have been prepared.

Sanskit Text: दिवस कण्वास इन्दवो वसु सिन्धूनां पदे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divas kaṇvāsa indavo vasu sindhūnāṃ pade |
Translation: 9 Kaṇvas, the drops are in the heaven; the wealth is at the waters' place:

Sanskit Text: सवं वव्रिं कुह धित्सथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svaṃ vavriṃ kuha dhitsathaḥ ||
Translation: Where will ye manifest your form?

Sanskit Text: अभूदु भा उ अंशवे हिरण्यं परति सूर्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhūdu bhā u aṃśave hiraṇyaṃ prati sūryaḥ |
Translation: 10 Light came to lighten up the branch, the Sun appeared as it were gold:

Sanskit Text: वयख्यज्जिह्वयासितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyakhyajjihvayāsitaḥ ||
Translation: And with its tongue shone forth the dark.

Sanskit Text: अभूदु पारमेतवे पन्था रतय्स साधुया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhūdu pārametave panthā ṛtaysa sādhuyā |
Translation: 11 The path of sacrifice was made to travel to the farther goal:

Sanskit Text: अदर्शि वि सरुतिर्दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adarśi vi srutirdivaḥ ||
Translation: The road of heaven was manifest.

Sanskit Text: तत-तदिदश्विनोरवो जरिता परति भूषति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat-tadidaśvinoravo jaritā prati bhūṣati |
Translation: 12 The singer of their praise awaits whatever grace the Aśvins give,

Sanskit Text: मदे सोमस्यपिप्रतोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: made somasyapipratoḥ ||
Translation: who save when Soma gladdens them.

Sanskit Text: वावसाना विवस्वति सोमस्य पीत्या गिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāvasānā vivasvati somasya pītyā ghirā |
Translation: 13 Ye dwellers with Vivasvān come, auspicious, as to Manu erst;

Sanskit Text: मनुष्वच्छम्भूा गतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manuṣvacchambhūā ghatam ||
Translation: come to the Soma and our praise.

Sanskit Text: युवोरुषा अनु शरियं परिज्मनोरुपाचरत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvoruṣā anu śriyaṃ parijmanorupācarat |
Translation: 14 O circumambient Aśvins, Dawn follows the brightness of your way:

Sanskit Text: रता वनथो अक्तुभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtā vanatho aktubhiḥ ||
Translation: Approve with beams our solemn rites.

Sanskit Text: उभा पिबतमश्विनोभा नः शर्म यछतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhā pibatamaśvinobhā naḥ śarma yachatam |
Translation: 15 Drink ye of our libations, grant protection, O ye Aśvins Twain,

Sanskit Text: अविद्रियाभिरूतिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avidriyābhirūtibhiḥ ||
Translation: With aids which none may interrupt.

Sanskit Text: अयं वां मधुमत्तमः सुतः सोम रताव्र्धा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ vāṃ madhumattamaḥ sutaḥ soma ṛtāvṛdhā |
Translation: 1 AŚVINS, for you who strengthen Law this sweetest Soma hath been shed.

Sanskit Text: तमश्विना पिबतं तिरोह्न्यं धत्तं रत्नानि दाशुशे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamaśvinā pibataṃ tiroahnyaṃ dhattaṃ ratnāni dāśuśe ||
Translation: Drink this expressed ere yesterday and give riches to him who offers it.

Sanskit Text: तरिवन्धुरेण तरिव्र्ता सुपेशसा रथेना यातमश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trivandhureṇa trivṛtā supeśasā rathenā yātamaśvinā |
Translation: 2 Come, O ye Aśvins, mounted on your triple car three-seated, beautiful of form

Sanskit Text: कण्वासो वां बरह्म कर्ण्वन्त्यध्वरे तेषां सु शर्णुतं हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaṇvāso vāṃ brahma kṛṇvantyadhvare teṣāṃ su śṛṇutaṃ havam ||
Translation: To you at sacrifice the Kaṇvas send the prayer: graciously listen to their call.

Sanskit Text: अश्विना मधुमत्तमं पातं सोमं रताव्र्धा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvinā madhumattamaṃ pātaṃ somaṃ ṛtāvṛdhā |
Translation: 3 O Aśvins, ye who strengthen Law, drink ye this sweetest Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: अथाद्य दस्रा वसु बिभ्रता रथे दाश्वांसमुप गछतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athādya dasrā vasu bibhratā rathe dāśvāṃsamupa ghachatam ||
Translation: Borne on your wealth-fraught car come ye this day to him who offers, ye of wondrous deeds.

Sanskit Text: तरिषधस्थे बर्हिषि विश्ववेदसा मध्वा यज्ञं मिमिक्षतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: triṣadhasthe barhiṣi viśvavedasā madhvā yajñaṃ mimikṣatam |
Translation: 4 Omniscient Aśvins, on the thrice-heaped grass bedew with the sweet juice the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: कण्वासो वां सुतसोमा अभिद्यवो युवां हवन्ते अश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaṇvāso vāṃ sutasomā abhidyavo yuvāṃ havante aśvinā ||
Translation: The sons of Kaṇva, striving heavenward, call on you with draughts of Soma juice out-poured.

Sanskit Text: याभिः कण्वमभिष्टिभिः परावतं युवमश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ kaṇvamabhiṣṭibhiḥ prāvataṃ yuvamaśvinā |
Translation: 5 O Aśvins, with those aids wherewith ye guarded Kaṇva carefully,

Sanskit Text: ताभिः षवस्मानवतं शुभस पती पातं सोमं रताव्र्धा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tābhiḥ ṣvasmānavataṃ śubhas patī pātaṃ somaṃ ṛtāvṛdhā ||
Translation: Keep us, O Lords of Splendour: drink the Soma juice, ye strengtheners of holy law.

Sanskit Text: सुदासे दस्रा वसु बिभ्रता रथे पर्क्षो वहतमश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sudāse dasrā vasu bibhratā rathe pṛkṣo vahatamaśvinā |
Translation: 6 O Mighty Ones, ye gave Sudās abundant food, brought on your treasure-laden car;

Sanskit Text: रयिं समुद्रादुत वा दिवस पर्यस्मे धत्तं पुरुस्प्र्हम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rayiṃ samudrāduta vā divas paryasme dhattaṃ puruspṛham ||
Translation: So now vouchsafe to us the wealth which many crave, either from heaven or from the sea.

Sanskit Text: यन नासत्या परावति यद वा सथो अधि तुर्वशे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yan nāsatyā parāvati yad vā stho adhi turvaśe |
Translation: 7 Nāsatyas, whether ye be far away or close to Turvaśa,

Sanskit Text: अतो रथेन सुव्र्ता न आ गतं साकं सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ato rathena suvṛtā na ā ghataṃ sākaṃ sūryasya raśmibhiḥ ||
Translation: Borne on your lightly-rolling chariot come to us, together with the sunbeams come.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाञ्चा वां सप्तयो.अध्वरश्रियो वहन्तु सवनेदुप |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāñcā vāṃ saptayo.adhvaraśriyo vahantu savanedupa |
Translation: 8 So let your coursers, ornaments of sacrifice, bring you to our libations here.

Sanskit Text: इषं पर्ञ्चन्ता सुक्र्ते सुदानव आ बर्हिः सीदतं नरा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣaṃ pṛñcantā sukṛte sudānava ā barhiḥ sīdataṃ narā ||
Translation: Bestowing food on him who acts and gives aright, sit, Chiefs, upon the sacred grass.

Sanskit Text: तेन नासत्या गतं रथेन सूर्यत्वचा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tena nāsatyā ghataṃ rathena sūryatvacā |
Translation: 9 Come, O Nāsatyas, on your car decked with a sunbright canopy,

Sanskit Text: येन शश्वदूहथुर्दाशुषे वसु मध्वः सोमस्य पीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena śaśvadūhathurdāśuṣe vasu madhvaḥ somasya pītaye ||
Translation: Whereon ye ever bring wealth to the worshipper, to drink the Soma's pleasant juice.

Sanskit Text: उक्थेभिरर्वागवसे पुरूवसू अर्कैश्च नि हवयामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukthebhirarvāghavase purūvasū arkaiśca ni hvayāmahe |
Translation: 10 With lauds and songs of praise we call them down to us, that they, most rich, may succour us;

Sanskit Text: शश्वत कण्वानां सदसि परिये हि कं सोमं पपथुरश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaśvat kaṇvānāṃ sadasi priye hi kaṃ somaṃ papathuraśvinā ||
Translation: For ye have ever in the Kaṇvas' well-loved house, O Aśvins, drunk the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: सह वामेन न उषो वयुछा दुहितर्दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saha vāmena na uṣo vyuchā duhitardivaḥ |
Translation: 1 DAWN on us with prosperity, O Uṣas, Daughter of the Sky,

Sanskit Text: सह दयुम्नेन बर्हता विभावरि राया देवि दास्वती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saha dyumnena bṛhatā vibhāvari rāyā devi dāsvatī ||
Translation: Dawn with great glory, Goddess, Lady of the Light, dawn thou with riches, Bounteous One.

Sanskit Text: अश्वावतीर्गोमतीर्विश्वसुविदो भूरि चयवन्त वस्तवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvāvatīrghomatīrviśvasuvido bhūri cyavanta vastave |
Translation: 2 They, bringing steeds and kine, boon-givers of all wealth, have oft sped forth to lighten us.

Sanskit Text: उदीरय परति मा सून्र्ता उषश्चोद राधो मघोनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: udīraya prati mā sūnṛtā uṣaścoda rādho maghonām ||
Translation: O Uṣas, waken up for me the sounds of joy: send us the riches of the great.

Sanskit Text: उवासोषा उछाच्च नु देवी जीरा रथानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uvāsoṣā uchācca nu devī jīrā rathānām |
Translation: 3 Uṣas hath dawned, and now shall dawn, the Goddess, driver forth of cars

Sanskit Text: ये अस्या आचरणेषु दध्रिरे समुद्रे न शरवस्यवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye asyā ācaraṇeṣu dadhrire samudre na śravasyavaḥ ||
Translation: Which, as she cometh nigh, have fixed their thought on her, like glory-seekers on the flood.

Sanskit Text: उषो ये ते पर यामेषु युञ्जते मनो दानाय सूरयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣo ye te pra yāmeṣu yuñjate mano dānāya sūrayaḥ |
Translation: 4 Here Kaṇva, chief of Kaṇva's race, sings forth aloud the glories of the heroes’ names,—

Sanskit Text: अत्राह तत कण्व एषां कण्वतमो नाम गर्णाति नर्णाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrāha tat kaṇva eṣāṃ kaṇvatamo nāma ghṛṇāti nṛṇām ||
Translation: The. princes who, O Uṣas, as thou comest near, direct their thoughts to liberal gifts.

Sanskit Text: आ घा योषेव सूनर्युषा याति परभुञ्जती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ghā yoṣeva sūnaryuṣā yāti prabhuñjatī |
Translation: 5 Like a good matron Uṣas comes carefully tending everything:

Sanskit Text: जरयन्ती वर्जनं पद्वदीयत उत पातयति पक्षिणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jarayantī vṛjanaṃ padvadīyata ut pātayati pakṣiṇaḥ ||
Translation: Rousing all life she stirs all creatures that have feet, and makes the birds of air fly up.

Sanskit Text: वि या सर्जति समनं वयर्थिनः पदां न वेत्योदती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yā sṛjati samanaṃ vyarthinaḥ padāṃ na vetyodatī |
Translation: 6 She sends the busy forth, each man to his pursuit: delay she knows not as she springs.

Sanskit Text: वयो नकिष टे पप्तिवांस आसते वयुष्टौ वाजिनीवति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayo nakiṣ ṭe paptivāṃsa āsate vyuṣṭau vājinīvati ||
Translation: O rich in opulence, after thy dawning birds that have flown forth no longer rest.

Sanskit Text: एषायुक्त परावतः सूर्यस्योदयनादधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣāyukta parāvataḥ sūryasyodayanādadhi |
Translation: 7 This Dawn hath yoked her steeds afar, beyond the rising of the Sun:

Sanskit Text: शतं रथेभिः सुभगोषा इयं वि यात्यभि मानुषान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ rathebhiḥ subhaghoṣā iyaṃ vi yātyabhi mānuṣān ||
Translation: Borne on a hundred chariots she, auspicious Dawn, advances on her way to Men.

Sanskit Text: विश्वमस्या नानाम चक्षसे जगज्ज्योतिष कर्णोति सूनरी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvamasyā nānāma cakṣase jaghajjyotiṣ kṛṇoti sūnarī |
Translation: 8 To meet her glance all living creatures bend them down: Excellent One, she makes the light.

Sanskit Text: अप दवेषो मघोनी दुहिता दिव उषा उछदप सरिधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa dveṣo maghonī duhitā diva uṣā uchadapa sridhaḥ ||
Translation: Uṣas, the Daughter of the Sky, the opulent, shines foes and enmities away.

Sanskit Text: उष आ भाहि भानुना चन्द्रेण दुहितर्दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣa ā bhāhi bhānunā candreṇa duhitardivaḥ |
Translation: 9 Shine on us with thy radiant light, O Uṣas, Daughter of the Sky,

Sanskit Text: आवहन्ती भूर्यस्मभ्यं सौभगं वयुछन्ती दिविष्टिषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvahantī bhūryasmabhyaṃ saubhaghaṃ vyuchantī diviṣṭiṣu ||
Translation: Bringing to us great store of high felicity, and beaming on our solemn rites.

Sanskit Text: विश्वस्य हि पराणनं जीवनं तवे वि यदुछसि सूनरि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvasya hi prāṇanaṃ jīvanaṃ tve vi yaduchasi sūnari |
Translation: 10 For in thee is each living creature's breath and life, when, Excellent! thou dawnest forth.

Sanskit Text: सा नो रथेन बर्हता विभावरि शरुधि चित्रामघे हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā no rathena bṛhatā vibhāvari śrudhi citrāmaghe havam ||
Translation: Borne on thy lofty car, O Lady of the Light, hear, thou of wondrous wealth, our call.

Sanskit Text: उषो वाजं हि वंस्व यश्चित्रो मानुषे जने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣo vājaṃ hi vaṃsva yaścitro mānuṣe jane |
Translation: 11 O Uṣas, win thyself the strength which among men is wonderful.

Sanskit Text: तेना वह सुक्र्तो अध्वरानुप ये तवा गर्णन्ति वह्नयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tenā vaha sukṛto adhvarānupa ye tvā ghṛṇanti vahnayaḥ ||
Translation: Bring thou thereby the pious unto holy rites, those who as priests sing praise to thee.

Sanskit Text: विश्वान देवाना वह सोमपीतये.अन्तरिक्षादुषस्त्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvān devānā vaha somapītaye.antarikṣāduṣastvam |
Translation: 12 Bring from the firmament, O Uṣas, all the Gods, that they may drink our Soma juice,

Sanskit Text: सास्मासु धा गोमदश्वावदुक्थ्यमुषो वाजं सुवीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sāsmāsu dhā ghomadaśvāvadukthyamuṣo vājaṃ suvīryam ||
Translation: And, being what thou art, vouchsafe us kine and steeds, strength meet for praise and hero might.

Sanskit Text: यस्या रुशन्तो अर्चयः परति भद्रा अद्र्क्षत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasyā ruśanto arcayaḥ prati bhadrā adṛkṣata |
Translation: 13 May Uṣas whose auspicious rays are seen resplendent round about,

Sanskit Text: सा नो रयिं विश्ववारं सुपेशसमुषा ददातु सुग्म्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā no rayiṃ viśvavāraṃ supeśasamuṣā dadātu sughmyam ||
Translation: Grant us great riches, fair in form, of all good things, wealth which light labour may attain.

Sanskit Text: ये चिद धि तवां रषयः पूर्व ऊतये जुहूरे.अवसे महि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye cid dhi tvāṃ ṛṣayaḥ pūrva ūtaye juhūre.avase mahi |
Translation: 14 Mighty One, whom the Ṛṣis of old time invoked for their protection and their help,

Sanskit Text: सा न सतोमानभि गर्णीहि राधसोषः शुक्रेण शोचिषा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā na stomānabhi ghṛṇīhi rādhasoṣaḥ śukreṇa śociṣā ||
Translation: O Uṣas, graciously answer our songs of praise with bounty and with brilliant light.

Sanskit Text: उषो यदद्य भानुना वि दवाराव रणवो दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣo yadadya bhānunā vi dvārāv ṛṇavo divaḥ |
Translation: 15 Uṣas, as thou with light to day hast opened the twin doors of heaven,

Sanskit Text: पर नो यछतादव्र्कं पर्थु छर्दिः पर देवि गोमतीरिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra no yachatādavṛkaṃ pṛthu chardiḥ pra devi ghomatīriṣaḥ ||
Translation: So grant thou us a dwelling wide and free from foes. O Goddess, give us food with kine.

Sanskit Text: सं नो राया बर्हता विश्वपेशसा मिमिक्ष्वा समिळाभिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ no rāyā bṛhatā viśvapeśasā mimikṣvā samiḷābhirā |
Translation: 16 Bring us to wealth abundant, sent in every shape, to plentiful refreshing food,

Sanskit Text: सं दयुम्नेन विश्वतुरोषो महि सं वाजैर्वाजिनीवति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ dyumnena viśvaturoṣo mahi saṃ vājairvājinīvati ||
Translation: To all-subduing splendour, Uṣas, Mighty One, to strength, thou rich in spoil and wealth.

Sanskit Text: उषो भद्रेभिरा गहि दिवश्चिद रोचनादधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣo bhadrebhirā ghahi divaścid rocanādadhi |
Translation: 1 E'EN from above the sky's bright realm come, Uṣas, by auspicious ways:

Sanskit Text: वहन्त्वरुणप्सव उप तवा सोमिनो गर्हम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vahantvaruṇapsava upa tvā somino ghṛham ||
Translation: Let red steeds bear thee to the house of him who pours the Soma, juice.

Sanskit Text: सुपेशसं सुखं रथं यमध्यस्था उषस्त्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: supeśasaṃ sukhaṃ rathaṃ yamadhyasthā uṣastvam |
Translation: 2 The chariot which thou mountest, fair of shape, O Uṣas light to move,—

Sanskit Text: तेना सुश्रवसं जनं परावाद्य दुहितर्दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tenā suśravasaṃ janaṃ prāvādya duhitardivaḥ ||
Translation: Therewith, O Daughter of the Sky, aid men of noble fame today.

Sanskit Text: वयश्चित ते पतत्रिणो दविपच्चतुष्पदर्जुनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaścit te patatriṇo dvipaccatuṣpadarjuni |
Translation: 3 Bright Uṣas, when thy times return, all quadrupeds and bipeds stir,

Sanskit Text: उषः परारन्न्र्तून्रनु दिवो अन्तेभ्यस परि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣaḥ prārannṛtūnranu divo antebhyas pari ||
Translation: And round about flock winged birds from all the boundaries of heaven.

Sanskit Text: वयुछन्ती हि रश्मिभिर्विश्वमाभासि रोचनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyuchantī hi raśmibhirviśvamābhāsi rocanam |
Translation: 4 Thou dawning with thy beams of light illumest all the radiant realm.

Sanskit Text: तां तवामुषर्वसूयवो गीर्भिः कण्वा अहूषत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāṃ tvāmuṣarvasūyavo ghīrbhiḥ kaṇvā ahūṣata ||
Translation: Thee, as thou art, the Kaṇvas, fain for wealth, have called with sacred songs.

Sanskit Text: उदु तयं जातवेदसं देवं वहन्ति केतवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udu tyaṃ jātavedasaṃ devaṃ vahanti ketavaḥ |
Translation: 1 HIS bright rays bear him up aloft, the God who knoweth all that lives,

Sanskit Text: दर्शे विश्वाय सूर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dṛśe viśvāya sūryam ||
Translation: Sūrya, that all may look on him.

Sanskit Text: अप तये तायवो यथा नक्षत्रा यन्त्यक्तुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa tye tāyavo yathā nakṣatrā yantyaktubhiḥ |
Translation: 2 The constellations pass away, like thieves, together with their beams,

Sanskit Text: सूराय विश्वचक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūrāya viśvacakṣase ||
Translation: Before the all-beholding Sun.

Sanskit Text: अद्र्श्रमस्य केतवो वि रश्मयो जनाननु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adṛśramasya ketavo vi raśmayo janānanu |
Translation: 3 His herald rays are seen afar refulgent o’er the world of men,

Sanskit Text: भराजन्तो अग्नयो यथा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhrājanto aghnayo yathā ||
Translation: Like flames of fire that burn and blaze.

Sanskit Text: तरणिर्विश्वदर्शतो जयोतिष्क्र्दसि सूर्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taraṇirviśvadarśato jyotiṣkṛdasi sūrya |
Translation: 4 Swift and all beautiful art thou, O Sūrya, maker of the light,

Sanskit Text: विश्वमा भासिरोचनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvamā bhāsirocanam ||
Translation: Illuming all the radiant realm.

Sanskit Text: परत्यं देवानां विशः परत्यङङ उदेषि मानुषान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratyaṃ devānāṃ viśaḥ pratyaṅṅ udeṣi mānuṣān |
Translation: 5 Thou goest to the hosts of Gods, thou comest hither to mankind,

Sanskit Text: परत्यं विश्वं सवर्द्र्शे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratyaṃ viśvaṃ svardṛśe ||
Translation: Hither all light to be beheld.

Sanskit Text: येना पावक चक्षसा भुरण्यन्तं जनाननु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenā pāvaka cakṣasā bhuraṇyantaṃ janānanu |
Translation: 6 With that same eye of thine wherewith thou lookest brilliant Varuṇa,

Sanskit Text: तवं वरुण पश्यसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ varuṇa paśyasi ||
Translation: Upon the busy race of men,

Sanskit Text: वि दयामेषि रजस पर्थ्वहा मिमानो अक्तुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi dyāmeṣi rajas pṛthvahā mimāno aktubhiḥ |
Translation: 7 Traversing sky and wide mid-air, thou metest with thy beams our days,

Sanskit Text: पश्यञ जन्मानि सूर्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: paśyañ janmāni sūrya ||
Translation: Sun, seeing all things that have birth.

Sanskit Text: सप्त तवा हरितो रथे वहन्ति देव सूर्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sapta tvā harito rathe vahanti deva sūrya |
Translation: 8 Seven Bay Steeds harnessed to thy car bear thee, O thou farseeing One,

Sanskit Text: शोचिष्केशं विचक्षण ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śociṣkeśaṃ vicakṣaṇa ||
Translation: God, Sūrya, with the radiant hair.

Sanskit Text: अयुक्त सप्त शुन्ध्युवः सूरो रथस्य नप्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayukta sapta śundhyuvaḥ sūro rathasya naptyaḥ |
Translation: 9 Sūrya hath yoked the pure bright Seven, the daughters of the car; with these,

Sanskit Text: ताभिर्याति सवयुक्तिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tābhiryāti svayuktibhiḥ ||
Translation: His own dear team, he goeth forth.

Sanskit Text: उद वयं तमसस परि जयोतिष पश्यन्त उत्तरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud vayaṃ tamasas pari jyotiṣ paśyanta uttaram |
Translation: 10 Looking upon the loftier light above the darkness we have come

Sanskit Text: देवं देवत्रा सूर्यमगन्म जयोतिरुत्तमम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devaṃ devatrā sūryamaghanma jyotiruttamam ||
Translation: To Sūrya, God among the Gods, the light that is most excellent.

Sanskit Text: उद्यन्नद्य मित्रमह आरोहन्नुत्तरां दिवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udyannadya mitramaha ārohannuttarāṃ divam |
Translation: 11 Rising this day, O rich in friends, ascending to the loftier heaven,

Sanskit Text: हर्द्रोगं ममसूर्य हरिमाणं च नाशय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hṛdroghaṃ mamasūrya harimāṇaṃ ca nāśaya ||
Translation: Sūrya remove my heart's disease, take from me this my yellow hue.

Sanskit Text: शुकेषु मे हरिमाणं रोपणाकासु दध्मसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śukeṣu me harimāṇaṃ ropaṇākāsu dadhmasi |
Translation: 12 To parrots and to starlings let us give away my yellowness,

Sanskit Text: अथो हारिद्रवेषु मे हरिमाणं नि दध्मसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atho hāridraveṣu me harimāṇaṃ ni dadhmasi ||
Translation: Or this my yellowness let us transfer to Haritāla trees.

Sanskit Text: उदगादयमादित्यो विश्वेन सहसा सह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udaghādayamādityo viśvena sahasā saha |
Translation: 13 With all his conquering vigour this Āditya hath gone up on high,

Sanskit Text: दविषन्तं मह्यं रन्धयन मो अहम दविषते रधम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dviṣantaṃ mahyaṃ randhayan mo aham dviṣate radham ||
Translation: Giving my foe into mine hand: let me not be my foeman's prey.

Sanskit Text: अभि तयं मेषं पुरुहूतं रग्मियमिन्द्रं गीर्भिर्मदता वस्वो अर्णवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tyaṃ meṣaṃ puruhūtaṃ ṛghmiyamindraṃ ghīrbhirmadatā vasvo arṇavam |
Translation: 1 MAKE glad with songs that Ram whom many men invoke, worthy of songs of praise, Indra, the sea of wealth;

Sanskit Text: यस्य दयावो न विचरन्ति मानुषा भुजे मंहिष्ठमभि विप्रमर्चत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya dyāvo na vicaranti mānuṣā bhuje maṃhiṣṭhamabhi vipramarcata ||
Translation: Whose gracious deeds for men spread like the heavens abroad: sing praise to him the Sage, most liberal for our good.

Sanskit Text: अभीमवन्वन सवभिष्टिमूतयो.अन्तरिक्षप्रां तविषीभिराव्र्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhīmavanvan svabhiṣṭimūtayo.antarikṣaprāṃ taviṣībhirāvṛtam |
Translation: 2 As aids the skilful Ṛbhus yearned to Indra strong to save, who fills mid-air, encompassed round with might,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं दक्षास रभवो मदच्युतं शतक्रतुं जवनी सून्र्तारुहत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ dakṣāsa ṛbhavo madacyutaṃ śatakratuṃ javanī sūnṛtāruhat ||
Translation: Rushing in rapture; and o’er Śatakratu came the gladdening shout that urged him on to victory.

Sanskit Text: तवं गोत्रमङगिरोभ्यो.अव्र्णोरपोतात्रये शतदुरेषु गातुवित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ ghotramaṅghirobhyo.avṛṇorapotātraye śatadureṣu ghātuvit |
Translation: 3 Thou hast disclosed the kine's stall for the Aṅgirases, and made a way for Atri by a hundred doors.

Sanskit Text: ससेन चिद विमदायावहो वस्वाजावद्रिं वावसानस्यनर्तयन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sasena cid vimadāyāvaho vasvājāvadriṃ vāvasānasyanartayan ||
Translation: On Vimada thou hast bestowed both food and wealth, making thy bolt dance in the sacrificer's fight.

Sanskit Text: तवमपामपिधानाव्र्णोर अपाधारयः पर्वते दानुमद वसु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamapāmapidhānāvṛṇor apādhārayaḥ parvate dānumad vasu |
Translation: 4 Thou hast unclosed the prisons of the waters; thou hast in the mountain seized the treasure rich in gifts.

Sanskit Text: वर्त्रं यदिन्द्र शवसावधीरहिमादित सूर्यं दिव्यारोहयो दर्शे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛtraṃ yadindra śavasāvadhīrahimādit sūryaṃ divyārohayo dṛśe ||
Translation: When thou hadst slain with might the dragon Vṛtra, thou, Indra, didst raise the Sun in heaven for all to see.

Sanskit Text: तवं मायाभिरप मायिनो.अधमः सवधाभिर्ये अधि शुप्तावजुह्वत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ māyābhirapa māyino.adhamaḥ svadhābhirye adhi śuptāvajuhvata |
Translation: 5 With wondrous might thou blewest enchanter fiends away, with powers celestial those who called on thee in jest.

Sanskit Text: तवं पिप्रोर्न्र्मणः परारुजः पुरः पर रजिश्वानं दस्युहत्येष्वाविथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ piprornṛmaṇaḥ prārujaḥ puraḥ pra ṛjiśvānaṃ dasyuhatyeṣvāvitha ||
Translation: Thou, hero-hearted, hast broken down Pipru's forts, and helped Ṛjiśvan when the Dasyus were struck dead.

Sanskit Text: तवं कुत्सं शुष्णहत्येष्वाविथारन्धयो.अतिथिग्वाय शम्बरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ kutsaṃ śuṣṇahatyeṣvāvithārandhayo.atithighvāya śambaram |
Translation: 6 Thou savedst Kutsa when Śuṣṇa was smitten down; to Atithigva gavest Śambara for a prey.

Sanskit Text: महान्तं चिदर्बुदं नि करमीः पदा सनादेव दस्युहत्याय जज्ञिषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahāntaṃ cidarbudaṃ ni kramīḥ padā sanādeva dasyuhatyāya jajñiṣe ||
Translation: E’en mighty Arbuda thou troddest under foot: thou from of old wast born to strike the Dasyus dead.

Sanskit Text: तवे विश्वा तविषी सध्र्यग घिता तव राधः सोमपीथाय हर्षते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve viśvā taviṣī sadhryagh ghitā tava rādhaḥ somapīthāya harṣate |
Translation: 7 All power and might is closely gathered up in thee; thy bounteous spirit joys in drinking Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: तव वज्रश्चिकिते बाह्वोर्हितो वर्श्चा शत्रोरव विश्वानि वर्ष्ण्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava vajraścikite bāhvorhito vṛścā śatrorava viśvāni vṛṣṇyā ||
Translation: Known is the thunderbolt that lies within thine arms: rend off therewith all manly prowess of our foe.

Sanskit Text: वि जानीह्यार्यान ये च दस्यवो बर्हिष्मते रन्धया शासदव्रतान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi jānīhyāryān ye ca dasyavo barhiṣmate randhayā śāsadavratān |
Translation: 8 Discern thou well Āryas and Dasyus; punishing the lawless give them up to him whose grass is strewn.

Sanskit Text: शाकी भव यजमानस्य चोदिता विश्वेत ता ते सधमादेषु चाकन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śākī bhava yajamānasya coditā viśvet tā te sadhamādeṣu cākana ||
Translation: Be thou the sacrificer's strong encourager all these thy deeds are my delight at festivals.

Sanskit Text: अनुव्रताय रन्धयन्नपव्रतानाभूभिरिन्द्रः शनथयन्ननाभुवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anuvratāya randhayannapavratānābhūbhirindraḥ śnathayannanābhuvaḥ |
Translation: 9 Indra gives up the lawless to the pious man, destroying by the Strong Ones those who have no strength.

Sanskit Text: वर्द्धस्य चिद वर्धतो दयामिनक्षत सतवानो वम्रो वि जघान सन्दिहः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛddhasya cid vardhato dyāminakṣata stavāno vamro vi jaghāna sandihaḥ ||
Translation: Vamra when glorified destroyed the gathered piles of the still waxing great one who would reach the heaven.

Sanskit Text: तक्षद यत त उशना सहसा सहो वि रोदसी मज्मना बाधते शवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: takṣad yat ta uśanā sahasā saho vi rodasī majmanā bādhate śavaḥ |
Translation: 10 The might which Uśanā hath formed for thee with might rends in its greatness and with strength both worlds apart.

Sanskit Text: आ तवा वातस्य नर्मणो मनोयुज आ पूर्यमाणमवहन्नभि शरवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tvā vātasya nṛmaṇo manoyuja ā pūryamāṇamavahannabhi śravaḥ ||
Translation: O Hero-souled, the steeds of Vāta, yoked by thought, have carried thee to fame while thou art filled with power.

Sanskit Text: मन्दिष्ट यदुशने काव्ये सचानिन्द्रो वङकू वङकुतराधि तिष्ठति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mandiṣṭa yaduśane kāvye sacānindro vaṅkū vaṅkutarādhi tiṣṭhati |
Translation: 11 When Indra hath rejoiced with Kāvya Uśanā, he mounts his steeds who swerve wider and wider yet.

Sanskit Text: उग्रो ययिं निरपः सरोतसास्र्जद वि शुष्णस्य दरंहिता ऐरयत पुरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughro yayiṃ nirapaḥ srotasāsṛjad vi śuṣṇasya dṛṃhitā airayat puraḥ ||
Translation: The Strong hath loosed his bolt with the swift rush of rain, and he hath rent in pieces Śuṣṇa's firm-built forts.

Sanskit Text: आ समा रथं वर्षपाणेषु तिष्ठसि शार्यातस्य परभ्र्तायेषु मन्दसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā smā rathaṃ vṛṣapāṇeṣu tiṣṭhasi śāryātasya prabhṛtāyeṣu mandase |
Translation: 12 Thou mountest on thy car amid strong Soma draughts: Śāryāta brought thee those in which thou hast delight.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र यथा सुतसोमेषु चाकनो.अनर्वाणंश्लोकमा रोहसे दिवि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra yathā sutasomeṣu cākano.anarvāṇaṃślokamā rohase divi ||
Translation: Indra, when thou art pleased with men whose Soma flows thou risest to unchallenged glory in the sky.

Sanskit Text: अददा अर्भां महते वचस्यवे कक्षीवते वर्चयामिन्द्र सुन्वते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adadā arbhāṃ mahate vacasyave kakṣīvate vṛcayāmindra sunvate |
Translation: 13 To old Kakṣīvān, Soma-presser, skilled in song, O Indra, thou didst give the youthful Vṛcayā.

Sanskit Text: मेनाभवो वर्षणश्वस्य सुक्रतो विश्वेत ता ते सवनेषु परवाच्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: menābhavo vṛṣaṇaśvasya sukrato viśvet tā te savaneṣu pravācyā ||
Translation: Thou, very wise, wast Menā, Vrsanśva's child: those deeds of thine must all be told at Soma feasts.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो अश्रायि सुध्यो निरेके पज्रेषु सतोमो दुर्यो न यूपः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro aśrāyi sudhyo nireke pajreṣu stomo duryo na yūpaḥ |
Translation: 14 The good man's refuge in his need is Indra, firm as a doorpost, praised among the Pajras.

Sanskit Text: अश्वयुर्गव्यू रथयुर्वसूयुरिन्द्र इद रायः कषयति परयन्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvayurghavyū rathayurvasūyurindra id rāyaḥ kṣayati prayantā ||
Translation: Indra alone is Lord of wealth, the Giver, lover of riches, chariots, kine, and horses.

Sanskit Text: इदं नमो वर्षभाय सवराजे सत्यशुष्माय तवसे.अवाचि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ namo vṛṣabhāya svarāje satyaśuṣmāya tavase.avāci |
Translation: 15 To him the Mighty One, the self-resplendent, verily strong and great, this praise is uttered.

Sanskit Text: अस्मिन्निन्द्र वर्जने सर्ववीराः समत सूरिभिस्तव शर्मन सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asminnindra vṛjane sarvavīrāḥ smat sūribhistava śarman syāma ||
Translation: May we and all the heroes, with the princes, be, in this fray, O Indra, in thy keeping.

Sanskit Text: तयं सु मेषं महया सवर्विदं शतं यस्य सुभ्वः साकमीरते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tyaṃ su meṣaṃ mahayā svarvidaṃ śataṃ yasya subhvaḥ sākamīrate |
Translation: 1 I GLORIFY that Ram who finds the light of heaven, whose hundred nobly-natured ones go forth with him.

Sanskit Text: अत्यं न वाजं हवनस्यदं रथमेन्द्रं वव्र्त्यामवसे सुव्र्क्तिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atyaṃ na vājaṃ havanasyadaṃ rathamendraṃ vavṛtyāmavase suvṛktibhiḥ ||
Translation: With hymns may I turn hither Indra to mine aid,—the Car which like a strong steed hasteth to the call.

Sanskit Text: स पर्वतो न धरुणेष्वच्युतः सहस्रमूतिस्तविषीषु वाव्र्धे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa parvato na dharuṇeṣvacyutaḥ sahasramūtistaviṣīṣu vāvṛdhe |
Translation: 2 Like as a mountain on firm basis, unremoved, he, thousandfold protector, waxed in mighty strength,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो यद वर्त्रमवधीन नदीव्र्तमुब्जन्नर्णांसिजर्ह्र्षाणो अन्धसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro yad vṛtramavadhīn nadīvṛtamubjannarṇāṃsijarhṛṣāṇo andhasā ||
Translation: When Indra, joying in the draughts of Soma juice, forced the clouds, slaying Vṛtra stayer of their flow.

Sanskit Text: स हि दवरो दवरिषु वव्र ऊधनि चन्द्रबुध्नो मदव्र्द्धो मनीषिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi dvaro dvariṣu vavra ūdhani candrabudhno madavṛddho manīṣibhiḥ |
Translation: 3 For he stays e’en the stayers, spread o’er laden cloud, rooted in light, strengthened in rapture by the wise.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं तमह्वे सवपस्यया धिया मंहिष्ठरातिं स हि पप्रिरन्धसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ tamahve svapasyayā dhiyā maṃhiṣṭharātiṃ sa hi paprirandhasaḥ ||
Translation: Indra with thought, with skilled activity, I call, most liberal giver, for he sates him with the juice.

Sanskit Text: आ यं पर्णन्ति दिवि सद्मबर्हिषः समुद्रं न सुभ्वः सवा अभिष्टयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yaṃ pṛṇanti divi sadmabarhiṣaḥ samudraṃ na subhvaḥ svā abhiṣṭayaḥ |
Translation: 4 Whom those that flow in heaven on sacred grass, his own assistants, nobly-natured, fill full like the sea,—

Sanskit Text: तं वर्त्रहत्ये अनु तस्थुरूतयः शुष्मािन्द्रमवाता अह्रुतप्सवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vṛtrahatye anu tasthurūtayaḥ śuṣmāindramavātā ahrutapsavaḥ ||
Translation: Beside that Indra when he smote down Vṛtra stood his helpers, straight in form, mighty, invincible.

Sanskit Text: अभि सवव्र्ष्टिं मदे अस्य युध्यतो रघ्वीरिव परवणे सस्रुरूतयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi svavṛṣṭiṃ made asya yudhyato raghvīriva pravaṇe sasrurūtayaḥ |
Translation: 5 To him, as in wild joy he fought with him who stayed the rain, his helpers sped like swift streams down a slope,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो यद वज्री धर्षमाणो अन्धसा भिनद वलस्य परिधीन्रिव तरितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro yad vajrī dhṛṣamāṇo andhasā bhinad valasya paridhīnriva tritaḥ ||
Translation: When Indra, thunder-armed, made bold by Soma draughts, as Tṛta cleaveth Vala's fences, cleft him through.

Sanskit Text: परीं घर्णा चरति तित्विषे शवो.अपो वर्त्वी रजसो बुध्नमाशयत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parīṃ ghṛṇā carati titviṣe śavo.apo vṛtvī rajaso budhnamāśayat |
Translation: 6 Splendour encompassed thee, forth shone thy warrior might: the rain-obstructer lay in mid-air's lowest deep,

Sanskit Text: वर्त्रस्य यत परवणे दुर्ग्र्भिश्वनो निजघन्थ हन्वोरिन्द्र तन्यतुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛtrasya yat pravaṇe durghṛbhiśvano nijaghantha hanvorindra tanyatum ||
Translation: What time, O Indra, thou didst cast thy thunder down upon the jaws of Vṛitra hard to be restrained.

Sanskit Text: हरदं न हि तवा नय्र्षन्त्यूर्मयो बरह्माणीन्द्र तव यानि वर्धना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hradaṃ na hi tvā nyṛṣantyūrmayo brahmāṇīndra tava yāni vardhanā |
Translation: 7 The hymns which magnify thee, Indra, reach to thee even as water-brooks flow down and fill the lake.

Sanskit Text: तवष्टा चित ते युज्यं वाव्र्धे शवस्ततक्ष वज्रमभिभूत्योजसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṣṭā cit te yujyaṃ vāvṛdhe śavastatakṣa vajramabhibhūtyojasam ||
Translation: Tvaṣṭar gave yet more force to thine appropriate strength, and forged thy thunderbolt of overpowering might.

Sanskit Text: जघन्वानु हरिभिः सम्भ्र्तक्रतविन्द्र वर्त्रं मनुषे गातुयन्नपः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jaghanvānu haribhiḥ sambhṛtakratavindra vṛtraṃ manuṣe ghātuyannapaḥ |
Translation: 8 When, Indra, thou whose power is linked with thy Bay Steeds hadst smitten Vṛtra, causing floods to flow for man,

Sanskit Text: अयछथा बाह्वोर्वज्रमायसमधारयो दिव्या सूर्यं दर्शे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayachathā bāhvorvajramāyasamadhārayo divyā sūryaṃ dṛśe ||
Translation: Thou heldst in thine arms the metal thunderbolt, and settest in the heaven the Sun for all to see.

Sanskit Text: बर्हत सवश्चन्द्रममवद यदुक्थ्यमक्र्ण्वत भियसा रोहणं दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhat svaścandramamavad yadukthyamakṛṇvata bhiyasā rohaṇaṃ divaḥ |
Translation: 9 In fear they raised the lofty self-resplendent hymn, praise giving and effectual, leading up to heaven,

Sanskit Text: यन मानुषप्रधना इन्द्रमूतयः सवर्न्र्षाचो मरुतो.अमदन्ननु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yan mānuṣapradhanā indramūtayaḥ svarnṛṣāco maruto.amadannanu ||
Translation: When Indra's helpers fighting for the good of men, the Maruts, faithful to mankind, joyed in the light.

Sanskit Text: दयौश्चिदस्यामवानहेः सवनादयोयवीद भियसा वज्र इन्द्र ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyauścidasyāmavānaheḥ svanādayoyavīd bhiyasā vajra indra te |
Translation: 10 Then Heaven himself, the mighty, at that Dragon's roar reeled back in terror when, Indra, thy thunderbolt

Sanskit Text: वर्त्रस्य यद बद्बधानस्य रोदसी मदे सुतस्य शवसाभिनच्छिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛtrasya yad badbadhānasya rodasī made sutasya śavasābhinacchiraḥ ||
Translation: In the wild joy of Soma had struck off with might the head of Vṛtra, tyrant of the earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: यदिन नविन्द्र पर्थिवी दशभुजिरहानि विश्वा ततनन्तक्र्ष्टयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadin nvindra pṛthivī daśabhujirahāni viśvā tatanantakṛṣṭayaḥ |
Translation: 11 O Indra, were this earth extended forth tenfold, and men who dwell therein multiplied day by day,

Sanskit Text: अत्राह ते मघवन विश्रुतं सहो दयामनु शवसा बर्हणा भुवत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrāha te maghavan viśrutaṃ saho dyāmanu śavasā barhaṇā bhuvat ||
Translation: Still here thy conquering might, Maghavan, would be famed: it hath waxed vast as heaven in majesty and power.

Sanskit Text: तवमस्य पारे रजसो वयोमनः सवभूत्योजा अवसे धर्षन्मनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamasya pāre rajaso vyomanaḥ svabhūtyojā avase dhṛṣanmanaḥ |
Translation: 12 Thou, bold of heart, in thine own native might, for help, upon the limit of this mid-air and of heaven,

Sanskit Text: चक्र्षे भूमिं परतिमानमोजसो.अपः सवः परिभूरेष्या दिवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakṛṣe bhūmiṃ pratimānamojaso.apaḥ svaḥ paribhūreṣyā divam ||
Translation: Hast made the earth to be the pattern of thy strength: embracing flood and light thou reachest to the sky.

Sanskit Text: तवं भुवः परतिमानं पर्थिव्या रष्ववीरस्य बर्हतः पतिर्भूः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ bhuvaḥ pratimānaṃ pṛthivyā ṛṣvavīrasya bṛhataḥ patirbhūḥ |
Translation: 13 Thou art the counterpart of earth, the Master of lofty heaven with all its mighty Heroes:

Sanskit Text: विश्वमाप्रा अन्तरिक्षं महित्वा सत्यमद्धा नकिरन्यस्त्वावान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvamāprā antarikṣaṃ mahitvā satyamaddhā nakiranyastvāvān ||
Translation: Thou hast filled all the region with thy greatness: yea, of a truth there is none other like thee.

Sanskit Text: न यस्य दयावाप्र्थिवी अनु वयचो न सिन्धवो रजसो अन्तमानशुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yasya dyāvāpṛthivī anu vyaco na sindhavo rajaso antamānaśuḥ |
Translation: 14 Whose amplitude the heaven and earth have not attained, whose bounds the waters of mid-air have never reached,—

Sanskit Text: नोत सवव्र्ष्टिं मदे अस्य युध्यत एको अन्यच्चक्र्षे विश्वमानुषक ||
