Sanskrit Transliteration: nota svavṛṣṭiṃ made asya yudhyata eko anyaccakṛṣe viśvamānuṣak ||
Translation: Not, when in joy he fights the stayer of the rain: thou, and none else, hast made all things in order due.

Sanskit Text: आर्चन्नत्र मरुतः सस्मिन्नाजौ विश्वे देवासो अमदन्ननुत्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ārcannatra marutaḥ sasminnājau viśve devāso amadannanutvā |
Translation: 15 The Maruts sang thy praise in this encounter, and in thee all the Deities delighted,

Sanskit Text: वर्त्रस्य यद भर्ष्टिमता वधेन नि तवमिन्द्र परत्यानं जघन्थ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛtrasya yad bhṛṣṭimatā vadhena ni tvamindra pratyānaṃ jaghantha ||
Translation: What time thou, Indra, with thy spiky weapon, thy deadly bolt, smotest the face of Vṛtra.

Sanskit Text: नयू षु वाचं पर महे भरामहे गिर इन्द्राय सदने विवस्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nyū ṣu vācaṃ pra mahe bharāmahe ghira indrāya sadane vivasvataḥ |
Translation: 1 WE will present fair praise unto the Mighty One, our hymns to Indra in Vivasvān's dwelling-place;

Sanskit Text: नू चिद धि रत्नं ससतामिवाविदन न दुष्टुतिर्द्रविणोदेषु शस्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū cid dhi ratnaṃ sasatāmivāvidan na duṣṭutirdraviṇodeṣu śasyate ||
Translation: For he hath ne’er found wealth in those who seem to sleep: those who give wealth to men accept no paltry praise.

Sanskit Text: दुरो अश्वस्य दुर इन्द्र गोरसि दुरो यवस्य वसुन इनस पतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: duro aśvasya dura indra ghorasi duro yavasya vasuna inas patiḥ |
Translation: 2 Giver of horses, Indra, giver, thou, of kine, giver of barley, thou art Lord and guard of wealth:

Sanskit Text: शिक्षानरः परदिवो अकामकर्शनः सखा सखिभ्यस्तमिदं गर्णीमसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śikṣānaraḥ pradivo akāmakarśanaḥ sakhā sakhibhyastamidaṃ ghṛṇīmasi ||
Translation: Man's helper from of old, not disappointing hope, Friend of our friends, to thee as such we sing this praise.

Sanskit Text: शचीव इन्द्र पुरुक्र्द दयुमत्तम तवेदिदमभितश्चेकिते वसु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śacīva indra purukṛd dyumattama tavedidamabhitaścekite vasu |
Translation: 3 Indra, most splendid, powerful, rich in mighty deeds, this treasure spread around is known to be thine own.

Sanskit Text: अतः संग्र्भ्याभिभूत आ भर मा तवायतो जरितुः काममूनयीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ataḥ saṃghṛbhyābhibhūta ā bhara mā tvāyato jarituḥ kāmamūnayīḥ ||
Translation: Gather therefrom, O Conqueror, and bring to us: fail not the hope of him who loves and sings to thee.

Sanskit Text: एभिर्द्युभिः सुमना एभिरिन्दुभिर्निरुन्धानो अमतिं गोभिरश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ebhirdyubhiḥ sumanā ebhirindubhirnirundhāno amatiṃ ghobhiraśvinā |
Translation: 4 Well pleased with these bright flames and with these Soma drops, take thou away our poverty with seeds and kine.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रेण दस्युं दरयन्त इन्दुभिर्युतद्वेषसःसमिषा रभेमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indreṇa dasyuṃ darayanta indubhiryutadveṣasaḥsamiṣā rabhemahi ||
Translation: With Indra scattering the Dasyu through these drops, freed from their hate may we obtain abundant food.

Sanskit Text: समिन्द्र राया समिषा रभेमहि सं वाजेभिः पुरुश्चन्द्रैरभिद्युभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samindra rāyā samiṣā rabhemahi saṃ vājebhiḥ puruścandrairabhidyubhiḥ |
Translation: 5 Let us obtain, O Indra, plenteous wealth and food, with strength exceeding glorious, shining to the sky:

Sanskit Text: सं देव्या परमत्या वीरशुष्मया गोग्रयाश्वावत्या रभेमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ devyā pramatyā vīraśuṣmayā ghoaghrayāśvāvatyā rabhemahi ||
Translation: May we obtain the Goddess Providence, the strength of heroes, special source of cattle, rich in steeds.

Sanskit Text: ते तवा मदा अमदन तानि वर्ष्ण्या ते सोमासो वर्त्रहत्येषु सत्पते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te tvā madā amadan tāni vṛṣṇyā te somāso vṛtrahatyeṣu satpate |
Translation: 6 These our libations strength-inspiring, Soma draughts, gladdened thee in the fight with Vṛtra, Hero Lord,

Sanskit Text: यत कारवे दश वर्त्राण्यप्रति बर्हिष्मते नि सहस्राणि बर्हयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat kārave daśa vṛtrāṇyaprati barhiṣmate ni sahasrāṇi barhayaḥ ||
Translation: What time thou slewest for the singer with trimmed grass ten thousand Vṛtras, thou resistless in thy might.

Sanskit Text: युधा युधमुप घेदेषि धर्ष्णुया पुरा पुरं समिदं हंस्योजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yudhā yudhamupa ghedeṣi dhṛṣṇuyā purā puraṃ samidaṃ haṃsyojasā |
Translation: 7 Thou goest on from fight to fight intrepidly, destroying castle after castle here with strength.

Sanskit Text: नम्या यदिन्द्र सख्या परावति निबर्हयो नमुचिं नाम मायिनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: namyā yadindra sakhyā parāvati nibarhayo namuciṃ nāma māyinam ||
Translation: Thou, Indra, with thy friend who makes the foe bow down, slewest from far away the guileful Namuci.

Sanskit Text: तवं करञ्जमुत पर्णयं वधीस्तेजिष्ठयातिथिग्वस्यवर्तनी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ karañjamuta parṇayaṃ vadhīstejiṣṭhayātithighvasyavartanī |
Translation: 8 Thou hast struck down in death Karañja, Parṇaya, in Atithigva's very glorious going forth.

Sanskit Text: तवं शता वङगर्दस्याभिनत पुरो.अनानुदः परिषूता रजिश्वना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ śatā vaṅghṛdasyābhinat puro.anānudaḥ pariṣūtā ṛjiśvanā ||
Translation: Unyielding, when Ṛjiśvan compassed them with siege, thou hast destroyed the hundred forts of Vaṅgṛida.

Sanskit Text: तवमेताञ जनराज्ञो दविर्दशाबन्धुना सुश्रवसोपजग्मुषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvametāñ janarājño dvirdaśābandhunā suśravasopajaghmuṣaḥ |
Translation: 9 With all-outstripping chariot-wheel, O Indra, thou far-famed, hast overthrown the twice ten Kings of men,

Sanskit Text: षष्टिं सहस्रा नवतिं नव शरुतो नि चक्रेण रथ्या दुष्पदाव्र्णक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrā navatiṃ nava śruto ni cakreṇa rathyā duṣpadāvṛṇak ||
Translation: With sixty thousand nine-and-ninety followers, who came in arms to fight with friendless Suśravas.

Sanskit Text: तवमाविथ सुश्रवसं तवोतिभिस्तव तरामभिरिन्द्र तूर्वयाणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamāvitha suśravasaṃ tavotibhistava trāmabhirindra tūrvayāṇam |
Translation: 10 Thou hast protected Suśravas with succour, and Tūrvayāṇa with thine aid, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: तवमस्मै कुत्समतिथिग्वमायुं महे राज्ञे यूने अरन्धनायः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamasmai kutsamatithighvamāyuṃ mahe rājñe yūne arandhanāyaḥ ||
Translation: Thou madest Kutsa, Atithigva, Āyu, subject unto this King, the young, the mighty.

Sanskit Text: य उद्र्चीन्द्र देवगोपाः सखायस्ते शिवतमा असाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya udṛcīndra devaghopāḥ sakhāyaste śivatamā asāma |
Translation: 11 May we protected by the Gods hereafter remain thy very prosperous friends, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: तवां सतोषाम तवया सुवीरा दराघीय आयुः परतरं दधानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ stoṣāma tvayā suvīrā drāghīya āyuḥ prataraṃ dadhānāḥ ||
Translation: Thee we extol, enjoying through thy favour life long and joyful and with store of heroes.

Sanskit Text: मा नो अस्मिन मघवन पर्त्स्वंहसि नहि ते अन्तः शवसः परीणशे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no asmin maghavan pṛtsvaṃhasi nahi te antaḥ śavasaḥ parīṇaśe |
Translation: 1 URGE us not, Maghavan, to this distressful fight, for none may comprehend the limit of thy strength.

Sanskit Text: अक्रन्दयो नद्यो रोरुवद वना कथा न कषोणीर्भियसा समारत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: akrandayo nadyo roruvad vanā kathā na kṣoṇīrbhiyasā samārata ||
Translation: Thou with fierce shout hast made the woods and rivers roar: did not men run in crowds together in their fear?

Sanskit Text: अर्चा शक्राय शाकिने शचीवते शर्ण्वन्तमिन्द्रं महयन्नभि षटुहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arcā śakrāya śākine śacīvate śṛṇvantamindraṃ mahayannabhi ṣṭuhi |
Translation: 2 Sing hymns of praise to Śakra, Lord of power and might; laud thou and magnify Indra who heareth thee,

Sanskit Text: यो धर्ष्णुना शवसा रोदसी उभे वर्षा वर्षत्वा वर्षभो नय्र्ञ्जते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo dhṛṣṇunā śavasā rodasī ubhe vṛṣā vṛṣatvā vṛṣabho nyṛñjate ||
Translation: Who with his daring might, a Bull exceeding strong in strength, maketh him master of the heaven and earth.

Sanskit Text: अर्चा दिवे बर्हते शूष्यं वचः सवक्षत्रं यस्य धर्षतो धर्षन मनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arcā dive bṛhate śūṣyaṃ vacaḥ svakṣatraṃ yasya dhṛṣato dhṛṣan manaḥ |
Translation: 3 Sing forth to lofty Dyaus a strength-bestowing song, the Bold, whose resolute mind hath independent sway.

Sanskit Text: बर्हच्छ्रवा असुरो बर्हणा कर्तः पुरो हरिभ्यां वर्षभो रथो हि षः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhacchravā asuro barhaṇā kṛtaḥ puro haribhyāṃ vṛṣabho ratho hi ṣaḥ ||
Translation: High glory hath the Asura, compact of strength, drawn on by two Bay Steeds: a Bull, a Car is he.

Sanskit Text: तवं दिवो बर्हतः सानु कोपयो.अव तमना धर्षता शम्बरं भिनत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ divo bṛhataḥ sānu kopayo.ava tmanā dhṛṣatā śambaraṃ bhinat |
Translation: 4 The ridges of the lofty heaven thou madest shake; thou, daring, of thyself smotest through Śambara,

Sanskit Text: यन मायिनो वरन्दिनो मन्दिना धर्षच्छितां गभस्तिमशनिं पर्तन्यसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yan māyino vrandino mandinā dhṛṣacchitāṃ ghabhastimaśaniṃ pṛtanyasi ||
Translation: When bold with gladdening juice, thou warredst with thy bolt, sharp and two-edged, against the banded sorcerers.

Sanskit Text: नि यद वर्णक्षि शवसनस्य मूर्धनि शुष्णस्य चिद वरन्दिनोरोरुवद वना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni yad vṛṇakṣi śvasanasya mūrdhani śuṣṇasya cid vrandinororuvad vanā |
Translation: 5 When with a roar that fills the woods, thou forcest down on wind's head the stores which Śuṣṇa kept confined,

Sanskit Text: पराचीनेन मनसा बर्हणावता यदद्या चित कर्णवः कस्त्वा परि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prācīnena manasā barhaṇāvatā yadadyā cit kṛṇavaḥ kastvā pari ||
Translation: Who shall have power to stay thee firm and eager-souled from doing still this day what thou of old hast done?

Sanskit Text: तवमाविथ नर्यं तुर्वशं यदुं तवं तुर्वीतिं वय्यंशतक्रतो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamāvitha naryaṃ turvaśaṃ yaduṃ tvaṃ turvītiṃ vayyaṃśatakrato |
Translation: 6 Thou helpest Narya, Turvaśa, and Yadu, and Vayya's son Turvīti, Śatakratu!

Sanskit Text: तवं रथमेतशं कर्त्व्ये धने तवं पुरो नवतिं दम्भयो नव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ rathametaśaṃ kṛtvye dhane tvaṃ puro navatiṃ dambhayo nava ||
Translation: Thou helpest horse and car in final battle thou breakest down the nine-and-ninety castles.

Sanskit Text: स घा राजा सत्पतिः शूशुवज्जनो रातहव्यः परति यः शासमिन्वति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ghā rājā satpatiḥ śūśuvajjano rātahavyaḥ prati yaḥ śāsaminvati |
Translation: 7 A hero-lord is he, King of a mighty folk, who offers free oblations and promotes the Law,

Sanskit Text: उक्था वा यो अभिग्र्णाति राधसा दानुरस्मा उपरा पिन्वते दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukthā vā yo abhighṛṇāti rādhasā dānurasmā uparā pinvate divaḥ ||
Translation: Who with a bounteous guerdon welcomes hymns of praise: for him flows down the abundant stream below the sky.

Sanskit Text: असमं कषत्रमसमा मनीषा पर सोमपा अपसा सन्तु नेमे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asamaṃ kṣatramasamā manīṣā pra somapā apasā santu neme |
Translation: 8 His power is matchless, matchless is his wisdom; chief, through their work, be some who drink the Soma,

Sanskit Text: ये त इन्द्र ददुषो वर्धयन्ति महि कषत्रं सथविरं वर्ष्ण्यं च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye ta indra daduṣo vardhayanti mahi kṣatraṃ sthaviraṃ vṛṣṇyaṃ ca ||
Translation: Those, Indra, who increase the lordly power, the firm heroic strength of thee the Giver.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्येदेते बहुला अद्रिदुग्धाश्चमूषदश्चमसा इन्द्रपानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyedete bahulā adridughdhāścamūṣadaścamasā indrapānāḥ |
Translation: 9 Therefore for thee are these abundant beakers Indra's drink, stone-pressed juices held in ladles.

Sanskit Text: वयश्नुहि तर्पया काममेषामथा मनो वसुदेयाय कर्ष्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyaśnuhi tarpayā kāmameṣāmathā mano vasudeyāya kṛṣva ||
Translation: Quaff them and satisfy therewith thy longing; then fix thy mind upon bestowing treasure.

Sanskit Text: अपामतिष्ठद धरुणह्वरं तमो.अन्तर्व्र्त्रस्य जठरेषुपर्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāmatiṣṭhad dharuṇahvaraṃ tamo.antarvṛtrasya jaṭhareṣuparvataḥ |
Translation: 10 There darkness stood, the vault that stayed the waters’ flow: in Vṛtra's hollow side the rain-cloud lay concealed.

Sanskit Text: अभीमिन्द्रो नद्यो वव्रिणा हिता विश्वा अनुष्ठाः परवणेषु जिघ्नते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhīmindro nadyo vavriṇā hitā viśvā anuṣṭhāḥ pravaṇeṣu jighnate ||
Translation: But Indra smote the rivers which the obstructer stayed, flood following after flood, down steep declivities.

Sanskit Text: स शेव्र्धमधि धा दयुम्नमस्मे महि कषत्रं जनाषाळिन्द्र तव्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa śevṛdhamadhi dhā dyumnamasme mahi kṣatraṃ janāṣāḷindra tavyam |
Translation: 11 So give us, Indra, bliss-increasing glory give us great sway and strength that conquers people.

Sanskit Text: रक्षा च नो मघोनः पाहि सूरीन राये च नः सवपत्या इषे धाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rakṣā ca no maghonaḥ pāhi sūrīn rāye ca naḥ svapatyā iṣe dhāḥ ||
Translation: Preserve our wealthy patrons, save our princes; vouchsafe us wealth and food with noble offspring.

Sanskit Text: दिवश्चिदस्य वरिमा वि पप्रथ इन्द्रं न मह्ना पर्थिवीचन परति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divaścidasya varimā vi papratha indraṃ na mahnā pṛthivīcana prati |
Translation: 1 THOUGH e’en this heaven's wide space and earth have spread them out, nor heaven nor earth may be in greatness Indra's match.

Sanskit Text: भीमस्तुविष्माञ्चर्षणिभ्य आतपः शिशीते वज्रं तेजसे न वंसगः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhīmastuviṣmāñcarṣaṇibhya ātapaḥ śiśīte vajraṃ tejase na vaṃsaghaḥ ||
Translation: Awful and very mighty, causing woe to men, he whets his thunderbolt for sharpness, as a bull.

Sanskit Text: सो अर्णवो न नद्यः समुद्रियः परति गर्भ्णाति विश्रिता वरीमभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: so arṇavo na nadyaḥ samudriyaḥ prati ghṛbhṇāti viśritā varīmabhiḥ |
Translation: 2 Like as the watery ocean, so doth he receive the rivers spread on all sides in their ample width.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रः सोमस्य पीतये वर्षायते सनात स युध्म ओजसा पनस्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraḥ somasya pītaye vṛṣāyate sanāt sa yudhma ojasā panasyate ||
Translation: He bears him like a bull to drink of Soma juice, and will, as Warrior from of old, be praised for might.

Sanskit Text: तवं तमिन्द्र पर्वतं न भोजसे महो नर्म्णस्य धर्मणामिरज्यसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tamindra parvataṃ na bhojase maho nṛmṇasya dharmaṇāmirajyasi |
Translation: 3 Thou swayest, Indra, all kinds of great manly power, so as to bend, as’t were, even that famed mountain down.

Sanskit Text: पर वीर्येण देवताति चेकिते विश्वस्मा उग्रः कर्मणे पुरोहितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vīryeṇa devatāti cekite viśvasmā ughraḥ karmaṇe purohitaḥ ||
Translation: Foremost among the Gods is he through hero might, set in the van, the Strong One, for each arduous deed.

Sanskit Text: स इद वने नमस्युभिर्वचस्यते चारु जनेषु परब्रुवाण इन्द्रियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa id vane namasyubhirvacasyate cāru janeṣu prabruvāṇa indriyam |
Translation: 4 He only in the wood is praised by worshippers, when he shows forth to men his own fair Indra-power.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा छन्दुर्भवति हर्यतो वर्षा कषेमेण धेनाम्मघवा यदिन्वति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā chandurbhavati haryato vṛṣā kṣemeṇa dhenāmmaghavā yadinvati ||
Translation: A friendly Bull is he, a Bull to be desired when Maghavan auspiciously sends forth his voice.

Sanskit Text: स इन महानि समिथानि मज्मना कर्णोति युध्म ओजसा जनेभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa in mahāni samithāni majmanā kṛṇoti yudhma ojasā janebhyaḥ |
Translation: 5 Yet verily the Warrior in his vigorous strength stirreth up with his might great battles for mankind;

Sanskit Text: अधा चन शरद दधति तविषीमत इन्द्राय वज्रं निघनिघ्नते वधम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā cana śrad dadhati tviṣīmata indrāya vajraṃ nighanighnate vadham ||
Translation: And men have faith in Indra, the resplendent One, what time he hurleth down his bolt, his dart of death.

Sanskit Text: स हि शरवस्युः सदनानि कर्त्रिमा कष्मया वर्धान ओजसाविनाशयन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi śravasyuḥ sadanāni kṛtrimā kṣmayā vṛdhāna ojasāvināśayan |
Translation: 6 Though, fain for glory, and with strength increased on earth, he with great might destroys the dwellings made with art,

Sanskit Text: जयोतींषि कर्ण्वन्नव्र्काणि यज्यवे.अव सुक्रतुः सर्तवा अपः सर्जत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyotīṃṣi kṛṇvannavṛkāṇi yajyave.ava sukratuḥ sartavā apaḥ sṛjat ||
Translation: He makes the lights of heaven shine forth secure, he bids, exceeding wise, the floods flow for his worshipper.

Sanskit Text: दानाय मनः सोमपावन्नस्तु ते.अर्वाञ्चा हरी वन्दनश्रुदा कर्धि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dānāya manaḥ somapāvannastu te.arvāñcā harī vandanaśrudā kṛdhi |
Translation: 7 Drinker of Soma, let thy heart incline to give; bring thy Bays hitherward, O thou who hearest praise.

Sanskit Text: यमिष्ठासः सारथयो य इन्द्र ते न तवा केताा दभ्नुवन्ति भूर्णयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamiṣṭhāsaḥ sārathayo ya indra te na tvā ketāā dabhnuvanti bhūrṇayaḥ ||
Translation: Those charioteers of thine, best skilled to draw the rein, the rapid sunbeams, Indra, lead thee not astray.

Sanskit Text: अप्रक्षितं वसु बिभर्षि हस्तयोरषाळ्हं सहस्तन्वि शरुतो दधे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aprakṣitaṃ vasu bibharṣi hastayoraṣāḷhaṃ sahastanvi śruto dadhe |
Translation: 8 Thou bearest in both hands treasure that never fails; the famed One in his body holds unvanquished might.

Sanskit Text: आव्र्तासो.अवतासो न कर्त्र्भिस्तनूषु ते करतवैन्द्र भूरयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvṛtāso.avatāso na kartṛbhistanūṣu te kratavaindra bhūrayaḥ ||
Translation: O Indra, in thy members many powers abide, like wells surrounded by the ministering priests.

Sanskit Text: एष पर पूर्वीरव तस्य चम्रिषो.अत्यो न योषामुदयंस्त भुर्वणिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa pra pūrvīrava tasya camriṣo.atyo na yoṣāmudayaṃsta bhurvaṇiḥ |
Translation: 1 FOR this man's full libations held in ladles, he hath roused him, eager, as a horse to meet the mare.

Sanskit Text: दक्षं महे पाययते हिरण्ययं रथमाव्र्त्या हरियोगं रभ्वसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dakṣaṃ mahe pāyayate hiraṇyayaṃ rathamāvṛtyā hariyoghaṃ ṛbhvasam ||
Translation: He stays his golden car, yoked with Bay Horses, swift, and drinks the Soma juice which strengthens for great deeds.

Sanskit Text: तं गूर्तयो नेमन्निषः परीणसः समुद्रं न संचरणे सनिष्यवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ ghūrtayo nemanniṣaḥ parīṇasaḥ samudraṃ na saṃcaraṇe saniṣyavaḥ |
Translation: 2 To him the guidance-following songs of praise flow full, as those who seek gain go in company to the flood.

Sanskit Text: पतिं दक्षस्य विदथस्य नू सहो गिरिं न वेना अधि रोह तेजसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: patiṃ dakṣasya vidathasya nū saho ghiriṃ na venā adhi roha tejasā ||
Translation: To him the Lord of power, the holy synod's might, as to a hill, with speed, ascend the loving ones.

Sanskit Text: स तुर्वणिर्महानरेणु पौंस्ये गिरेर्भ्र्ष्टिर्न भराजते तुजा शवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa turvaṇirmahānareṇu pauṃsye ghirerbhṛṣṭirna bhrājate tujā śavaḥ |
Translation: 3 Victorious, great is he; in manly battle shines, unstained with dust, his might, as shines a mountain peak;

Sanskit Text: येन शुष्णं मायिनमायसो मदे दुध्राभूषु रामयन नि दामनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena śuṣṇaṃ māyinamāyaso made dudhraābhūṣu rāmayan ni dāmani ||
Translation: Wherewith the iron one, fierce e’en against the strong, in rapture, fettered wily Śushṇa fast in bonds.

Sanskit Text: देवी यदि तविषी तवाव्र्धोतय इन्द्रं सिषक्त्युषसं न सूर्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devī yadi taviṣī tvāvṛdhotaya indraṃ siṣaktyuṣasaṃ na sūryaḥ |
Translation: 4 When Strength the Goddess, made more strong for help by thee, waits upon Indra as the Sun attends the Dawn,

Sanskit Text: यो धर्ष्णुना शवसा बाधते तम इयर्ति रेणुं बर्हदर्हरिष्वणिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo dhṛṣṇunā śavasā bādhate tama iyarti reṇuṃ bṛhadarhariṣvaṇiḥ ||
Translation: Then. he who with his might unflinching kills the gloom stirs up the dust aloft, with joy and triumphing.

Sanskit Text: वि यत तिरो धरुणमच्युतं रजो.अतिष्ठिपो दिव आतासुबर्हणा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yat tiro dharuṇamacyutaṃ rajo.atiṣṭhipo diva ātāsubarhaṇā |
Translation: 5 When thou with might, upon the framework of the heaven, didst fix, across, air's region firmly, unremoved,

Sanskit Text: सवर्मीळ्हे यन मद इन्द्र हर्ष्याहन वर्त्रं निरपामौब्जो अर्णवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svarmīḷhe yan mada indra harṣyāhan vṛtraṃ nirapāmaubjo arṇavam ||
Translation: In the light-winning war, Indra, in rapturous joy, thou smotest Vṛtra dead and broughtest floods of rain.

Sanskit Text: तवं दिवो धरुणं धिष ओजसा पर्थिव्या इन्द्र सदनेषु माहिनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ divo dharuṇaṃ dhiṣa ojasā pṛthivyā indra sadaneṣu māhinaḥ |
Translation: 6 Thou with thy might didst grasp, the holder-up of heaven, thou who art mighty also in the seats of earth.

Sanskit Text: तवं सुतस्य मदे अरिणा अपो वि वर्त्रस्य समया पाष्यारुजः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ sutasya made ariṇā apo vi vṛtrasya samayā pāṣyārujaḥ ||
Translation: Thou, gladdened by the juice, hast set the waters free, and broken Vṛtra's stony fences through and through.

Sanskit Text: पर मंहिष्ठाय बर्हते बर्हद्रये सत्यशुष्माय तवसे मतिं भरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra maṃhiṣṭhāya bṛhate bṛhadraye satyaśuṣmāya tavase matiṃ bhare |
Translation: 1 To him most liberal, lofty Lord of lofty wealth, verily powerful and strong, I bring my hymn,—

Sanskit Text: अपामिव परवणे यस्य दुर्धरं राधो विश्वायुशवसे अपाव्र्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāmiva pravaṇe yasya durdharaṃ rādho viśvāyuśavase apāvṛtam ||
Translation: Whose checkless bounty, as of waters down a slope, is spread abroad for all that live, to give them strength.

Sanskit Text: अध ते विश्वमनु हासदिष्टय आपो निम्नेव सवना हविष्मतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha te viśvamanu hāsadiṣṭaya āpo nimneva savanā haviṣmataḥ |
Translation: 2 Now all this world, for worship, shall come after thee—the offerer's libations like floods to the depth,

Sanskit Text: यत पर्वते न समशीत हर्यत इन्द्रस्य वज्रः शनथिता हिरण्ययः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat parvate na samaśīta haryata indrasya vajraḥ śnathitā hiraṇyayaḥ ||
Translation: When the well-loved one seems to rest upon the hill, the thunderbolt of Indra, shatterer wrought of gold.

Sanskit Text: अस्मै भीमाय नमसा समध्वर उषो न शुभ्र आ भरापनीयसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmai bhīmāya namasā samadhvara uṣo na śubhra ā bharāpanīyase |
Translation: 3 To him the terrible, most meet for lofty praise, like bright Dawn, now bring gifts with reverence in this rite,

Sanskit Text: यस्य धाम शरवसे नामेन्द्रियं जयोतिरकारिहरितो नायसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya dhāma śravase nāmendriyaṃ jyotirakāriharito nāyase ||
Translation: Whose being, for renown, yea, Indra-power and light, have been created, like bay steeds, to move with speed.

Sanskit Text: इमे त इन्द्र ते वयं पुरुष्टुत ये तवारभ्य चरामसि परभूवसो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime ta indra te vayaṃ puruṣṭuta ye tvārabhya carāmasi prabhūvaso |
Translation: 4 Thine, Indra, praised by many, excellently rich! are we who trusting in thy help draw near to thee.

Sanskit Text: नहि तवदन्यो गिर्वणो गिरः सघत कषोणीरिव परति नो हर्य तद वचः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi tvadanyo ghirvaṇo ghiraḥ saghat kṣoṇīriva prati no harya tad vacaḥ ||
Translation: Lover of praise, none else but thou receives our laud: as earth loves all her creatures, love thou this our hymn.

Sanskit Text: भूरि त इन्द्र वीर्यं तव समस्यस्य सतोतुर्मघवन काममा पर्ण |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūri ta indra vīryaṃ tava smasyasya stoturmaghavan kāmamā pṛṇa |
Translation: 5 Great is thy power, O Indra, we are thine. Fulfil, O Maghavan, the wish of this thy worshipper.

Sanskit Text: अनु ते दयौर्ब्र्हती वीर्यं मम इयं च ते पर्थिवी नेम ओजसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu te dyaurbṛhatī vīryaṃ mama iyaṃ ca te pṛthivī nema ojase ||
Translation: After thee lofty heaven hath measured out its strength: to thee and to thy power this earth hath bowed itself.

Sanskit Text: तवं तमिन्द्र पर्वतं महामुरुं वज्रेण वज्रिन पर्वशश्चकर्तिथ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tamindra parvataṃ mahāmuruṃ vajreṇa vajrin parvaśaścakartitha |
Translation: 6 Thou, who hast thunder for thy weapon, with thy bolt hast shattered into pieces this broad massive cloud.

Sanskit Text: अवास्र्जो निव्र्ताः सर्तवा अपः सत्रा विश्वं दधिषे केवलं सहः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avāsṛjo nivṛtāḥ sartavā apaḥ satrā viśvaṃ dadhiṣe kevalaṃ sahaḥ ||
Translation: Thou hast sent down the obstructed floods that they may flow: thou hast, thine own for ever, all victorious might.

Sanskit Text: नू चित सहोजा अम्र्तो नि तुन्दते होता यद दूतो अभवद विवस्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū cit sahojā amṛto ni tundate hotā yad dūto abhavad vivasvataḥ |
Translation: 1 NE’ER waxeth faint the Immortal, Son of Strength, since he, the Herald, hath become Vivasvān's messenger.

Sanskit Text: वि साधिष्ठेभिः पथिभी रजो मम आ देवताताहविषा विवासति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi sādhiṣṭhebhiḥ pathibhī rajo mama ā devatātāhaviṣā vivāsati ||
Translation: On paths most excellent he measured out mid-air: he with oblation calls to service of the Gods.

Sanskit Text: आ सवमद्म युवमानो अजरस्त्र्ष्वविष्यन्नतसेषु तिष्ठति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā svamadma yuvamāno ajarastṛṣvaviṣyannataseṣu tiṣṭhati |
Translation: 2 Never decaying, seizing his appropriate food, rapidly, eagerly through the dry wood he spreads.

Sanskit Text: अत्यो न पर्ष्ठं परुषितस्य रोचते दिवो न सानु सतनयन्नचिक्रदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atyo na pṛṣṭhaṃ pruṣitasya rocate divo na sānu stanayannacikradat ||
Translation: His back, as he is sprinkled, glistens like a horse: loud hath he roared and shouted like the heights of heaven?

Sanskit Text: कराणा रुद्रेभिर्वसुभिः पुरोहितो होता निषत्तो रयिषाळमर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: krāṇā rudrebhirvasubhiḥ purohito hotā niṣatto rayiṣāḷamartyaḥ |
Translation: 3 Set high in place o’er all that Vasus, Rudras do, immortal, Lord of riches, seated as High Priest;

Sanskit Text: रथो न विक्ष्व रञ्जसान आयुषु वयानुषग वार्या देव रण्वति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ratho na vikṣv ṛñjasāna āyuṣu vyānuṣagh vāryā deva ṛṇvati ||
Translation: Hastening like a car to men, to those who live, the God without delay gives boons to be desired.

Sanskit Text: वि वातजूतो अतसेषु तिष्ठते वर्था जुहूभिः सर्ण्या तुविष्वणिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi vātajūto ataseṣu tiṣṭhate vṛthā juhūbhiḥ sṛṇyā tuviṣvaṇiḥ |
Translation: 4 Urged by the wind be spreads through dry wood as he lists, armed with his tongues for sickles, with a mighty roar.

Sanskit Text: तर्षु यदग्ने वनिनो वर्षायसे कर्ष्णं त एम रुशदूर्मे अजर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tṛṣu yadaghne vanino vṛṣāyase kṛṣṇaṃ ta ema ruśadūrme ajara ||
Translation: Black is thy path, Agni, changeless, with glittering waves! when like a bull thou rushest eager to the trees.

Sanskit Text: तपुर्जम्भो वन आ वातचोदितो यूथे न साह्वानव वाति वंसगः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tapurjambho vana ā vātacodito yūthe na sāhvānava vāti vaṃsaghaḥ |
Translation: 5 With teeth of flame, wind-driven, through the wood he speeds, triumphant like a bull among the herd of cows,

Sanskit Text: अभिव्रजन्नक्षितं पाजसा रजः सथातुश्चरथं भयते पतत्रिणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhivrajannakṣitaṃ pājasā rajaḥ sthātuścarathaṃ bhayate patatriṇaḥ ||
Translation: With bright strength roaming to the everlasting air: things fixed, things moving quake before him as he flies.

Sanskit Text: दधुष टवा भर्गवो मानुषेष्वा रयिं न चारुं सुहवं जनेभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhuṣ ṭvā bhṛghavo mānuṣeṣvā rayiṃ na cāruṃ suhavaṃ janebhyaḥ |
Translation: 6 The Bhṛgus established thee among mankind for men, like as a treasure, beauteous, easy to invoke;

Sanskit Text: होतारमग्ने अतिथिं वरेण्यं मित्रं न शेवं दिव्याय जन्मने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotāramaghne atithiṃ vareṇyaṃ mitraṃ na śevaṃ divyāya janmane ||
Translation: Thee, Agni, as a herald and choice-worthy guest, as an auspicious Friend to the Celestial Race.

Sanskit Text: होतारं सप्त जुह्वो यजिष्ठं यं वाघतो वर्णते अध्वरेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotāraṃ sapta juhvo yajiṣṭhaṃ yaṃ vāghato vṛṇate adhvareṣu |
Translation: 7 Agni, the seven tongues' deftest Sacrificer, him whom the priests elect at solemn worship,

Sanskit Text: अग्निं विश्वेषामरतिं वसूनां सपर्यामि परयसा यामि रत्नम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ viśveṣāmaratiṃ vasūnāṃ saparyāmi prayasā yāmi ratnam ||
Translation: The Herald, messenger of all the Vasus, I serve with dainty food, I ask for riches.

Sanskit Text: अछिद्रा सूनो सहसो नो अद्य सतोत्र्भ्यो मित्रमहः शर्म यछ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: achidrā sūno sahaso no adya stotṛbhyo mitramahaḥ śarma yacha |
Translation: 8 Grant, Son of Strength, thou rich in friends, a refuge without a flaw this day to us thy praisers.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने गर्णन्तमंहस उरुष्योर्जो नपात पूर्भिरायसीभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne ghṛṇantamaṃhasa uruṣyorjo napāt pūrbhirāyasībhiḥ ||
Translation: O Agni, Son of Strength, with forts of iron preserve thou from distress the man who lauds thee.

Sanskit Text: भवा वरूथं गर्णते विभावो भवा मघवन मघवद्भ्यःशर्म |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhavā varūthaṃ ghṛṇate vibhāvo bhavā maghavan maghavadbhyaḥśarma |
Translation: 9 Be thou a refuge, Bright One, to the singer, a shelter, Bounteous Lord, to those who worship.

Sanskit Text: उरुष्याग्ने अंहसो गर्णन्तं परातर्मक्षू धियावसुर्जगम्यात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uruṣyāghne aṃhaso ghṛṇantaṃ prātarmakṣū dhiyāvasurjaghamyāt ||
Translation: Preserve the singer from distress, O Agni. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

Sanskit Text: वया इदग्ने अग्नयस्ते अन्ये तवे विश्वे अम्र्ता मादयन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayā idaghne aghnayaste anye tve viśve amṛtā mādayante |
Translation: 1 THE other fires are, verily, thy branches; the Immortals all rejoice in thee, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानर नाभिरसि कषितीनां सथूणेव जनानुपमिद ययन्थ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānara nābhirasi kṣitīnāṃ sthūṇeva janānupamid yayantha ||
Translation: Centre art thou, Vaiśvānara, of the people, sustaining men like a deep-founded pillar.

Sanskit Text: मूर्धा दिवो नाभिरग्निः पर्थिव्या अथाभवदरती रोदस्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mūrdhā divo nābhiraghniḥ pṛthivyā athābhavadaratī rodasyoḥ |
Translation: 2 The forehead of the sky, earth's centre, Agni became the messenger of earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा देवासो.अजनयन्त देवं वैश्वानर जयोतिरिदार्याय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā devāso.ajanayanta devaṃ vaiśvānara jyotiridāryāya ||
Translation: Vaiśvānara, the Deities produced thee, a God, to be a light unto the Ārya.

Sanskit Text: आ सूर्ये न रश्मयो धरुवासो वैश्वानरे दधिरे.अग्ना वसूनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā sūrye na raśmayo dhruvāso vaiśvānare dadhire.aghnā vasūni |
Translation: 3 As in the Sun firm rays are set for ever, treasures are in Vaiśvānara, in Agni.

Sanskit Text: या पर्वतेष्वोषधीष्वप्सु या मानुषेष्वसि तस्य राजा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā parvateṣvoṣadhīṣvapsu yā mānuṣeṣvasi tasya rājā ||
Translation: Of all the riches in the hills, the waters, the herbs, among mankind, thou art the Sovran.

Sanskit Text: बर्हती इव सूनवे रोदसी गिरो होता मनुष्यो न दक्षः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhatī iva sūnave rodasī ghiro hotā manuṣyo na dakṣaḥ |
Translation: 4 As the great World-halves, so are their Son's praises; skilled, as a man, to act, is he the Herald.

Sanskit Text: सवर्वते सत्यशुष्माय पूर्वीर्वैश्वानराय नर्तमाय यह्वीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svarvate satyaśuṣmāya pūrvīrvaiśvānarāya nṛtamāya yahvīḥ ||
Translation: Vaiśvānara, celestial, truly mighty, most manly One, hath many a youthful consort.

Sanskit Text: दिवश्चित ते बर्हतो जातवेदो वैश्वानर पर रिरिचे महित्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divaścit te bṛhato jātavedo vaiśvānara pra ririce mahitvam |
Translation: 5 Even the lofty heaven, O Jātavedas Vaiśvānara, hath not attained thy greatness.

Sanskit Text: राजा कर्ष्टीनामसि मानुषीणां युधा देवेभ्यो वरिवश्चकर्थ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājā kṛṣṭīnāmasi mānuṣīṇāṃ yudhā devebhyo varivaścakartha ||
Translation: Thou art the King of lands where men are settled, thou hast brought comfort to the Gods in battle.

Sanskit Text: पर नू महित्वं वर्षभस्य वोचं यं पूरवो वर्त्रहणं सचन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra nū mahitvaṃ vṛṣabhasya vocaṃ yaṃ pūravo vṛtrahaṇaṃ sacante |
Translation: 6 Now will I tell the greatness of the Hero whom Pūru's sons follow as Vṛtra's slayer:

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानरो दस्युमग्निर्जघन्वानधूनोत काष्ठा अव शम्बरं भेत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānaro dasyumaghnirjaghanvānadhūnot kāṣṭhā ava śambaraṃ bhet ||
Translation: Agni Vaiśvānara struck down the Dasyu, cleave Śambara through and shattered down his fences.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानरो महिम्ना विश्वक्र्ष्टिर्भरद्वाजेषु यजतो विभावा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānaro mahimnā viśvakṛṣṭirbharadvājeṣu yajato vibhāvā |
Translation: 7 Vaiśvānara, dwelling by his might with all men, far-shining, holy mid the Bharadvājas,

Sanskit Text: शातवनेये शतिनीभिरग्निः पुरुणीथे जरते सून्र्तावान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śātavaneye śatinībhiraghniḥ puruṇīthe jarate sūnṛtāvān ||
Translation: Is lauded, excellent, with hundred praises by Purūṇītha, son of Śatavani.

Sanskit Text: वह्निं यशसं विदथस्य केतुं सुप्राव्यं दूतं सद्योर्थम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vahniṃ yaśasaṃ vidathasya ketuṃ suprāvyaṃ dūtaṃ sadyoartham |
Translation: 1 As ’twere Some goodly treasure Mātariśvan brought, as a gift, the glorious Priest to Bhṛgu,

Sanskit Text: दविजन्मानं रयिमिव परशस्तं रातिं भरद भर्गवेमातरिश्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvijanmānaṃ rayimiva praśastaṃ rātiṃ bharad bhṛghavemātariśvā ||
Translation: Banner of sacrifice, the good Protector, child of two births, the swiftly moving envoy.

Sanskit Text: अस्य शासुरुभयासः सचन्ते हविष्मन्त उशिजो ये च मर्ताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya śāsurubhayāsaḥ sacante haviṣmanta uśijo ye ca martāḥ |
Translation: 2 Both Gods and men obey this Ruler's order, Gods who are worshipped, men who yearn and worship.

Sanskit Text: दिवश्चित पूर्वो नयसादि होताप्र्छ्यो विश्पतिर्विक्षुवेधाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divaścit pūrvo nyasādi hotāpṛchyo viśpatirvikṣuvedhāḥ ||
Translation: As Priest he takes his seat ere break of morning, House-Lord, adorable with men, Ordainer.

Sanskit Text: तं नव्यसी हर्द आ जायमानमस्मत सुकीर्तिर्मधुजिह्वमश्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ navyasī hṛda ā jāyamānamasmat sukīrtirmadhujihvamaśyāḥ |
Translation: 3 May our fair praise, heart-born, most recent, reach him whose tongue, e’en at his birth, is sweet as honey;

Sanskit Text: यं रत्विजो वर्जने मानुषासः परयस्वन्त आयवो जीजनन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ ṛtvijo vṛjane mānuṣāsaḥ prayasvanta āyavo jījananta ||
Translation: Whom mortal priests, men, with their strong endeavour, supplied with dainty viands, have created.

Sanskit Text: उशिक पावको वसुर्मानुषेषु वरेण्यो होताधायि विक्षु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uśik pāvako vasurmānuṣeṣu vareṇyo hotādhāyi vikṣu |
Translation: 4 Good to mankind, the yearning Purifier hath among men been placed as Priest choice-worthy.

Sanskit Text: दमूना गर्हपतिर्दम आ अग्निर्भुवद रयिपती रयीणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: damūnā ghṛhapatirdama ā aghnirbhuvad rayipatī rayīṇām ||
Translation: May Agni be our Friend, Lord of the Household, protector of the riches in the dwelling.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा वयं पतिमग्ने रयीणां पर शंसामो मतिभिर्गोतमासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā vayaṃ patimaghne rayīṇāṃ pra śaṃsāmo matibhirghotamāsaḥ |
Translation: 5 As such we Gotamas with hymns extol thee, O Agni, as the guardian Lord of riches,

Sanskit Text: आशुं न वाजम्भरं मर्जयन्तः परातर्मक्षू धियावसुर्जगम्यात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āśuṃ na vājambharaṃ marjayantaḥ prātarmakṣū dhiyāvasurjaghamyāt ||
Translation: Decking thee like a horse, the swift prizewinner. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

Sanskit Text: अस्मा इदु पर तवसे तुराय परयो न हर्मि सतोमं माहिनाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmā idu pra tavase turāya prayo na harmi stomaṃ māhināya |
Translation: 1 EVEN to him, swift, strong and high. exalted, I bring my song of praise as dainty viands,

Sanskit Text: रचीषमायाध्रिगव ओहमिन्द्राय बरह्माणि राततमा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛcīṣamāyādhrighava ohamindrāya brahmāṇi rātatamā ||
Translation: My thought to him resistless, praise-deserving, prayers offered most especially to Indra.

Sanskit Text: अस्मा इदु परय इव पर यंसि भराम्याङगूषं बाधे सुव्र्क्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmā idu praya iva pra yaṃsi bharāmyāṅghūṣaṃ bādhe suvṛkti |
Translation: 2 Praise, like oblation, I present, and utter aloud my song, my fair hymn to the Victor.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय हर्दा मनसा मनीषा परत्नाय पत्ये धियोमर्जयन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya hṛdā manasā manīṣā pratnāya patye dhiyomarjayanta ||
Translation: For Indra, who is Lord of old, the singers have decked their lauds with heart and mind and spirit.

Sanskit Text: अस्मा इदु तयमुपमं सवर्षां भराम्याङगूषमास्येन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmā idu tyamupamaṃ svarṣāṃ bharāmyāṅghūṣamāsyena |
Translation: 3 To him then with my lips mine adoration, winning heaven's light, most excellent, I offer,

Sanskit Text: मंहिष्ठमछोक्तिभिर्मतीनां सुव्र्क्तिभिः सूरिं वाव्र्धध्यै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maṃhiṣṭhamachoktibhirmatīnāṃ suvṛktibhiḥ sūriṃ vāvṛdhadhyai ||
Translation: To magnify with songs of invocation and with fair hymns the Lord, most bounteous Giver.

Sanskit Text: अस्मा इदु सतोमं सं हिनोमि रथं न तष्टेव तत्सिनाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmā idu stomaṃ saṃ hinomi rathaṃ na taṣṭeva tatsināya |
Translation: 4 Even for him I frame a laud, as fashions the wright a chariot for the man who needs it,—

Sanskit Text: गिरश्च गिर्वाहसे सुव्र्क्तीन्द्राय विश्वमिन्वं मेधिराय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghiraśca ghirvāhase suvṛktīndrāya viśvaminvaṃ medhirāya ||
Translation: Praises to him who gladly hears our praises, a hymn well-formed, all-moving, to wise Indra.

Sanskit Text: अस्मा इदु सप्तिमिव शरवस्येन्द्रायार्कं जुह्वा समञ्जे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmā idu saptimiva śravasyendrāyārkaṃ juhvā samañje |
Translation: 5 So with my tongue I deck, to please that Indra, my hymn, as ’twere a horse, through love of glory,

Sanskit Text: वीरं दानौकसं वन्दध्यै पुरां गूर्तश्रवसं दर्माणम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vīraṃ dānaukasaṃ vandadhyai purāṃ ghūrtaśravasaṃ darmāṇam ||
Translation: To reverence the Hero, bounteous Giver, famed far and wide, destroyer of the castles.

Sanskit Text: अस्मा इदु तवष्टा तक्षद वज्रं सवपस्तमं सवर्यं रणाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmā idu tvaṣṭā takṣad vajraṃ svapastamaṃ svaryaṃ raṇāya |
Translation: 6 Even for him hath Tvaṣṭar forged the thunder, most deftly wrought, celestial, for the battle,

Sanskit Text: वर्त्रस्य चिद विदद येन मर्म तुजन्नीशानस्तुजता कियेधाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛtrasya cid vidad yena marma tujannīśānastujatā kiyedhāḥ ||
Translation: Wherewith he reached the vital parts of Vṛtra, striking-the vast, the mighty with the striker.

Sanskit Text: अस्येदु मातुः सवनेषु सद्यो महः पितुं पपिवाञ्चार्वन्ना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asyedu mātuḥ savaneṣu sadyo mahaḥ pituṃ papivāñcārvannā |
Translation: 7 As soon as, at libations of his mother, great Viṣṇu had drunk up the draught, he plundered.

Sanskit Text: मुषायद विष्णुः पचतं सहीयान विध्यद वराहन्तिरो अद्रिमस्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: muṣāyad viṣṇuḥ pacataṃ sahīyān vidhyad varāhantiro adrimastā ||
Translation: The dainty cates, the cooked mess; but One stronger transfixed the wild boar, shooting through the mountain.

Sanskit Text: अस्मा इदु गनाश्चिद देवपत्नीरिन्द्रायार्कमहिहत्य ऊवुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmā idu ghnāścid devapatnīrindrāyārkamahihatya ūvuḥ |
Translation: 8 To him, to Indra, when he slew the Dragon, the Dames, too, Consorts of the Gods, wove praises.

Sanskit Text: परि दयावाप्र्थिवी जभ्र उर्वी नास्य ते महिमानं परिष्टः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari dyāvāpṛthivī jabhra urvī nāsya te mahimānaṃ pariṣṭaḥ ||
Translation: The mighty heaven and earth hath he encompassed: thy greatness heaven and earth, combined, exceed not.

Sanskit Text: अस्येदेव पर रिरिचे महित्वं दिवस पर्थिव्याः पर्यन्तरिक्षात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asyedeva pra ririce mahitvaṃ divas pṛthivyāḥ paryantarikṣāt |
Translation: 9 Yea, of a truth, his magnitude surpasseth the magnitude of earth, mid-air, and heaven.

Sanskit Text: सवराळ इन्द्रो दम आ विश्वगूर्तः सवरिरमत्रो ववक्षे रणाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svarāḷ indro dama ā viśvaghūrtaḥ svariramatro vavakṣe raṇāya ||
Translation: Indra, approved by all men, self-resplendent, waxed in his home, loud-voiced and strong for battle.

Sanskit Text: अस्येदेव शवसा शुषन्तं वि वर्श्चद वज्रेण वर्त्रमिन्द्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asyedeva śavasā śuṣantaṃ vi vṛścad vajreṇa vṛtramindraḥ |
Translation: 10 Through his own strength Indra with bolt of thunder cut piece-meal Vṛtra, drier up of waters.

Sanskit Text: गा न वराणा अवनीरमुञ्चदभि शरवो दावने सचेताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghā na vrāṇā avanīramuñcadabhi śravo dāvane sacetāḥ ||
Translation: He let the floods go free, like cows imprisoned, for glory, with a heart inclined to bounty.

Sanskit Text: अस्येदु तवेषसा रन्त सिन्धवः परि यद वज्रेण सीमयछत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asyedu tveṣasā ranta sindhavaḥ pari yad vajreṇa sīmayachat |
Translation: 11 The rivers played, through his impetuous splendour, since with his bolt he compassed them on all sides.

Sanskit Text: ईशानक्र्द दाशुषे दशस्यन तुर्वीतये गाधं तुर्वणिः कः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: īśānakṛd dāśuṣe daśasyan turvītaye ghādhaṃ turvaṇiḥ kaḥ ||
Translation: Using his might and favouring him who worshipped, he made a ford, victorious, for Turvīti.

Sanskit Text: अस्मा इदु पर भरा तूतुजानो वर्त्राय वज्रमीशानः कियेधाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmā idu pra bharā tūtujāno vṛtrāya vajramīśānaḥ kiyedhāḥ |
Translation: 12 Vast, with thine ample power, with eager movement, against this Vṛtra cast thy bolt of thunder.

Sanskit Text: गोर्न पर्व वि रदा तिरश्चेष्यन्नर्णांस्यपां चरध्यै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghorna parva vi radā tiraśceṣyannarṇāṃsyapāṃ caradhyai ||
Translation: Rend thou his joints, as of an ox, dissevered, with bolt oblique, that floods of rain may follow.

Sanskit Text: अस्येदु पर बरूहि पूर्व्याणि तुरस्य कर्माणि नव्य उक्थैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asyedu pra brūhi pūrvyāṇi turasya karmāṇi navya ukthaiḥ |
Translation: 13 Sing with new lauds his exploits wrought aforetime, the deeds of him, yea, him who moveth swiftly,

Sanskit Text: युधे यदिष्णान आयुधान्य रघायमाणो निरिणाति शत्रून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yudhe yadiṣṇāna āyudhāny ṛghāyamāṇo niriṇāti śatrūn ||
Translation: When, hurling forth his weapons in the battle, he with impetuous wrath lays low the foemen.

Sanskit Text: अस्येदु भिया गिरयश्च दर्ळ्हा दयावा च भूमा जनुषस्तुजेते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asyedu bhiyā ghirayaśca dṛḷhā dyāvā ca bhūmā januṣastujete |
Translation: 14 When he, yea, he, comes forth the firm. Set mountains and the whole heaven and earth, tremble for terror.

Sanskit Text: उपो वेनस्य जोगुवान ओणिं सद्यो भुवद वीर्याय नोधाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upo venasya joghuvāna oṇiṃ sadyo bhuvad vīryāya nodhāḥ ||
Translation: May Nodhas, ever praising the protection of that dear Friend, gain quickly strength heroic.

Sanskit Text: अस्मा इदु तयदनु दाय्येषामेको यद वव्ने भूरेरीशानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmā idu tyadanu dāyyeṣāmeko yad vavne bhūrerīśānaḥ |
Translation: 15 Now unto him of these things hath been given what he who rules alone o’er much, electeth.

Sanskit Text: परैतशं सूर्ये पस्प्र्धानं सौवश्व्ये सुष्विमावदिन्द्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: praitaśaṃ sūrye paspṛdhānaṃ sauvaśvye suṣvimāvadindraḥ ||
Translation: Indra hath helped Etaśa, Soma-presser, contending in the race of steeds with Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: एवा ते हारियोजना सुव्र्क्तीन्द्र बरह्माणि गोतमासो अक्रन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā te hāriyojanā suvṛktīndra brahmāṇi ghotamāso akran |
Translation: 16 Thus to thee, Indra, yoker of Bay Coursers, the Gotamas have brought their prayers to please thee.

Sanskit Text: ऐषु विश्वपेशसं धियं धाः परातर मक्षू धियावसुर जगम्यात||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aiṣu viśvapeśasaṃ dhiyaṃ dhāḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasur jaghamyāt||
Translation: Bestow upon them thought, decked with all beauty. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

Sanskit Text: पर मन्महे शवसानाय शूषमाङगूषं गिर्वणसे अङगिरस्वत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra manmahe śavasānāya śūṣamāṅghūṣaṃ ghirvaṇase aṅghirasvat |
Translation: 1. LIKE Aṅgiras a gladdening laud we ponder to him who loveth song, exceeding mighty.

Sanskit Text: सुव्र्क्तिभिः सतुवत रग्मियायार्चामार्कं नरे विश्रुताय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvṛktibhiḥ stuvata ṛghmiyāyārcāmārkaṃ nare viśrutāya ||
Translation: Let us sing glory to the far-famed Hero who must be praised with fair hymns by the singer.

Sanskit Text: पर वो महे महि नमो भरध्वमाङगूष्यं शवसानाय साम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vo mahe mahi namo bharadhvamāṅghūṣyaṃ śavasānāya sāma |
Translation: 2 Unto the great bring ye great adoration, a chant with praise to him exceeding mighty,

Sanskit Text: येना नः पूर्वे पितरः पदज्ञा अर्चन्तो अङगिरसो गा अविन्दन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ padajñā arcanto aṅghiraso ghā avindan ||
Translation: Through whom our sires, Aṅgirases, singing praises and knowing well the places, found the cattle.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्याङगिरसां चेष्टौ विदत सरमा तनयाय धासिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasyāṅghirasāṃ ceṣṭau vidat saramā tanayāya dhāsim |
Translation: 3 When Indra and the Aṅgirases desired it, Saramā found provision for her offspring.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिर्भिनदद्रिं विदद गाः समुस्रियाभिर्वावशन्त नरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatirbhinadadriṃ vidad ghāḥ samusriyābhirvāvaśanta naraḥ ||
Translation: Bṛhaspati cleft the mountain, found the cattle: the heroes shouted with the kine in triumph.

Sanskit Text: स सुष्टुभा स सतुभा सप्त विप्रैः सवरेणाद्रिं सवर्यो नवग्वैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa suṣṭubhā sa stubhā sapta vipraiḥ svareṇādriṃ svaryo navaghvaiḥ |
Translation: 4 Mid shout, loud shout, and roar, with the Navagvas, seven singers, hast thou, heavenly, rent the mountain;

Sanskit Text: सरण्युभिः फलिगमिन्द्र शक्र वलं रवेणदरयो दशग्वैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saraṇyubhiḥ phalighamindra śakra valaṃ raveṇadarayo daśaghvaiḥ ||
Translation: Thou hast, with speeders, with Daśagvas, Indra, Śakra, with thunder rent obstructive Vala.

Sanskit Text: गर्णानो अङगिरोभिर्दस्म वि वरुषसा सूर्येण गोभिरन्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛṇāno aṅghirobhirdasma vi varuṣasā sūryeṇa ghobhirandhaḥ |
Translation: 5 Praised by Aṅgirases, thou, foe-destroyer, hast, with the Dawn, Sun, rays, dispelled the darkness.

Sanskit Text: वि भूम्या अप्रथय इन्द्र सानु दिवो रज उपरमस्तभायः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi bhūmyā aprathaya indra sānu divo raja uparamastabhāyaḥ ||
Translation: Thou Indra, hast spread out the earth's high ridges, and firmly fixed the region under heaven.

Sanskit Text: तदु परयक्षतममस्य कर्म दस्मस्य चारुतममस्ति दंसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadu prayakṣatamamasya karma dasmasya cārutamamasti daṃsaḥ |
Translation: 6 This is the deed most worthy of all honour, the fairest marvel of the Wonder-Worker,

Sanskit Text: उपह्वरे यदुपरा अपिन्वन मध्वर्णसो नद्यश्चतस्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upahvare yaduparā apinvan madhvarṇaso nadyaścatasraḥ ||
Translation: That, nigh where heaven bends down, he made four rivers flow full with waves that carry down sweet water.

Sanskit Text: दविता वि वव्रे सनजा सनीळे अयास्य सतवमानेभिरर्कैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvitā vi vavre sanajā sanīḷe ayāsya stavamānebhirarkaiḥ |
Translation: 7 Unwearied, won with lauding hymns, he parted of old the ancient Pair, united ever.

Sanskit Text: भगो न मेने परमे वयोमन्नधारयद रोदसी सुदंसाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhagho na mene parame vyomannadhārayad rodasī sudaṃsāḥ ||
Translation: In highest sky like Bhaga, he the doer of marvels set both Dames and earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: सनाद दिवं परि भूमा विरूपे पुनर्भुवा युवती सवेभिरेवैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanād divaṃ pari bhūmā virūpe punarbhuvā yuvatī svebhirevaiḥ |
Translation: 8 Still born afresh, young Dames, each in her manner, unlike in hue, the Pair in alternation

Sanskit Text: कर्ष्णेभिरक्तोषा रुशद्भिर्वपुर्भिरा चरतो अन्यान्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṣṇebhiraktoṣā ruśadbhirvapurbhirā carato anyānyā ||
Translation: Round heaven and earth from ancient time have travelled, Night with her dark limbs, Dawn with limbs of splendour.

Sanskit Text: सनेमि सख्यं सवपस्यमानः सूनुर्दाधार शवसा सुदंसाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanemi sakhyaṃ svapasyamānaḥ sūnurdādhāra śavasā sudaṃsāḥ |
Translation: 9 Rich in good actions, skilled in operation, the Son with might maintains his perfect friendship.

Sanskit Text: आमासु चिद दधिषे पक्वमन्तः पयः कर्ष्णासु रुशद रोहिणीषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āmāsu cid dadhiṣe pakvamantaḥ payaḥ kṛṣṇāsu ruśad rohiṇīṣu ||
Translation: Thou in the raw cows, black of hue or ruddy, storest the ripe milk glossy white in colour.

Sanskit Text: सनात सनीला अवनीरवाता वरता रक्षन्ते अम्र्ताः सहोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanāt sanīlā avanīravātā vratā rakṣante amṛtāḥ sahobhiḥ |
Translation: 10 Their paths, of old connected, rest uninjured; they with great might preserve the immortal statutes.

Sanskit Text: पुरू सहस्रा जनयो न पत्नीर्दुवस्यन्ति सवसारो अह्रयाणम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purū sahasrā janayo na patnīrduvasyanti svasāro ahrayāṇam ||
Translation: For many thousand holy works the Sisters wait on the haughty Lord like wives and matrons.

Sanskit Text: सनायुवो नमसा नव्यो अर्कैर्वसूयवो मतयो दस्म दद्रुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanāyuvo namasā navyo arkairvasūyavo matayo dasma dadruḥ |
Translation: 11 Thoughts ancient, seeking wealth, with adoration, with newest lauds have sped to thee, O Mighty.

Sanskit Text: पतिं न पत्नीरुशतीरुशन्तं सप्र्शन्ति तवा शवसावन्मनीषाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: patiṃ na patnīruśatīruśantaṃ spṛśanti tvā śavasāvanmanīṣāḥ ||
Translation: As yearning wives cleave to their yearning husband, so cleave our hymns to thee, O Lord most potent.

Sanskit Text: सनादेव तव रायो गभस्तौ न कषीयन्ते नोप दस्यन्ति दस्म |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanādeva tava rāyo ghabhastau na kṣīyante nopa dasyanti dasma |
Translation: 12 Strong God, the riches which thy hands have holden from days of old have perished not nor wasted.

Sanskit Text: दयुमानसि करतुमानिन्द्र धीरः शिक्षा शचीवस्तव नः शचीभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyumānasi kratumānindra dhīraḥ śikṣā śacīvastava naḥ śacībhiḥ ||
Translation: Splendid art thou, O Indra, wise, unbending: strengthen us with might, O Lord of Power.

Sanskit Text: सनायते गोतम इन्द्र नव्यमतक्षद बरह्म हरियोजनाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanāyate ghotama indra navyamatakṣad brahma hariyojanāya |
Translation: 13 O mighty Indra, Gotama's son Nodhas hath fashioned this new prayer to thee Eternal,

Sanskit Text: सुनीथाय नः शवसान नोधाः परातर मक्षू धियावसुर जगम्यात||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sunīthāya naḥ śavasāna nodhāḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasur jaghamyāt||
Translation: Sure leader, yoker of the Tawny Coursers. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्णे शर्धाय सुमखाय वेधसे नोधः सुव्र्क्तिं पर भरा मरुद्भ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṇe śardhāya sumakhāya vedhase nodhaḥ suvṛktiṃ pra bharā marudbhyaḥ |
Translation: 1. BRING for the manly host, wise and majestical, O Nodhas, for the Maruts bring thou a pure gift.

Sanskit Text: अपो न धीरो मनसा सुहस्त्यो गिरः समञ्जे विदथेष्वाभुवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apo na dhīro manasā suhastyo ghiraḥ samañje vidatheṣvābhuvaḥ ||
Translation: I deck my songs as one deft-handed, wise in mind prepares the water that hath power in solemn rites.

Sanskit Text: ते जज्ञिरे दिव रष्वास उक्षणो रुद्रस्य मर्या असुरा अरेपसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te jajñire diva ṛṣvāsa ukṣaṇo rudrasya maryā asurā arepasaḥ |
Translation: 2 They spring to birth, the lofty Ones, the Bulls of Heaven, divine, the youths of Rudra, free from spot and stain;

Sanskit Text: पावकासः शुचयः सूर्या इव सत्वानो न दरप्सिनोघोरवर्पसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāvakāsaḥ śucayaḥ sūryā iva satvāno na drapsinoghoravarpasaḥ ||
Translation: The purifiers, shining brightly even as suns, awful of form like giants, scattering rain-drops down.

Sanskit Text: युवानो रुद्रा अजरा अभोग्घनो ववक्षुरध्रिगावः पर्वता इव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvāno rudrā ajarā abhoghghano vavakṣuradhrighāvaḥ parvatā iva |
Translation: 3 Young Rudras, demon-slayers, never growing old, they have waxed, even as mountains, irresistible.

Sanskit Text: दर्ळ्हा चिद विश्वा भुवनानि पार्थिवा पर चयावयन्तिदिव्यानि मज्मना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dṛḷhā cid viśvā bhuvanāni pārthivā pra cyāvayantidivyāni majmanā ||
Translation: They make all beings tremble with their mighty strength, even the very strongest, both of earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: चित्रैरञ्जिभिर्वपुषे वयञ्जते वक्षस्सु रुक्मानधि येतिरे शुभे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: citrairañjibhirvapuṣe vyañjate vakṣassu rukmānadhi yetire śubhe |
Translation: 4 With glittering ornaments they deck them forth for show; for beauty on their breasts they bind their chains of gold.

Sanskit Text: अंसेष्वेषां नि मिम्र्क्षुर रष्टयः साकं जज्ञिरे सवधया दिवो नरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṃseṣveṣāṃ ni mimṛkṣur ṛṣṭayaḥ sākaṃ jajñire svadhayā divo naraḥ ||
Translation: The lances on their shoulders pound to pieces; they were born together, of themselves, the Men of Heaven.

Sanskit Text: ईशानक्र्तो धुनयो रिशादसो वातान विद्युतस्तविषीभिरक्रत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īśānakṛto dhunayo riśādaso vātān vidyutastaviṣībhirakrata |
Translation: 5 Loud roarers, giving strength, devourers of the foe, they make the winds, they make the lightnings with their powers.

Sanskit Text: दुहन्त्यूधर्दिव्यानि धूतयो भूमिं पिन्वन्ति पयसापरिज्रयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: duhantyūdhardivyāni dhūtayo bhūmiṃ pinvanti payasāparijrayaḥ ||
Translation: The restless shakers drain the udders of the sky, and ever wandering round fill the earth full with milk.

Sanskit Text: पिन्वन्त्यपो मरुतः सुदानवः पयो घर्तवद विदथेष्वाभुवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pinvantyapo marutaḥ sudānavaḥ payo ghṛtavad vidatheṣvābhuvaḥ |
Translation: 6 The bounteous Maruts with the fatness dropping milk fill full the waters which avail in solemn rites.

Sanskit Text: अत्यं न मिहे वि नयन्ति वाजिनमुत्सं दुहन्ति सतनयन्तमक्षितम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atyaṃ na mihe vi nayanti vājinamutsaṃ duhanti stanayantamakṣitam ||
Translation: They lead, as ’twere, the Strong Horse forth, that it may rain: they milk the thundering, the never-failing spring.

Sanskit Text: महिषासो मायिनश्चित्रभानवो गिरयो न सवतवसो रघुष्यदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahiṣāso māyinaścitrabhānavo ghirayo na svatavaso raghuṣyadaḥ |
Translation: 7 Mighty, with wondrous power and marvellously bright, selfstrong like mountains, ye glide swiftly on your way.

Sanskit Text: मर्गा इव हस्तिनः खादथा वना यदारुणीषु तविषीरयुग्ध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mṛghā iva hastinaḥ khādathā vanā yadāruṇīṣu taviṣīrayughdhvam ||
Translation: Like the wild elephants ye eat the forests up when ye assume your strength among the bright red flames.

Sanskit Text: सिंहा इव नानदति परचेतसः पिशा इव सुपिशो विश्ववेदसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: siṃhā iva nānadati pracetasaḥ piśā iva supiśo viśvavedasaḥ |
Translation: 8 Exceeding wise they roar like lions mightily, they, all-possessing, are beauteous as antelopes;

Sanskit Text: कषपो जिन्वन्तः पर्षतीभिर रष्टिभिः समित सबाधः शवसाहिमन्यवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣapo jinvantaḥ pṛṣatībhir ṛṣṭibhiḥ samit sabādhaḥ śavasāhimanyavaḥ ||
Translation: Stirring the darkness with lances and spotted deer, combined as priests, with serpents' fury through their might.

Sanskit Text: रोदसी आ वदता गणश्रियो नर्षाचः शूराः शवसाहिमन्यवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rodasī ā vadatā ghaṇaśriyo nṛṣācaḥ śūrāḥ śavasāhimanyavaḥ |
Translation: 9 Heroes who march in companies, befriending man, with serpents' ire through strength, ye greet the earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: आ वन्धुरेष्वमतिर्न दर्शता विद्युन न तस्थौ मरुतो रथेषु वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vandhureṣvamatirna darśatā vidyun na tasthau maruto ratheṣu vaḥ ||
Translation: Upon the seats, O Maruts, of your chariots, upon the cars stands lightning visible as light.

Sanskit Text: विश्ववेदसो रयिभिः समोकसः सम्मिश्लासस्तविषीभिर्विरप्शिनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvavedaso rayibhiḥ samokasaḥ sammiślāsastaviṣībhirvirapśinaḥ |
Translation: 10 Lords of all riches, dwelling in the home of wealth, endowed with mighty vigour, singers loud of voice,

Sanskit Text: अस्तार इषुं दधिरे गभस्त्योरनन्तशुष्मा वर्षखादयो नरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: astāra iṣuṃ dadhire ghabhastyoranantaśuṣmā vṛṣakhādayo naraḥ ||
Translation: Heroes, of powers infinite, armed with strong men's rings, the archers, they have laid the arrow on their arms.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्ययेभिः पविभिः पयोव्र्ध उज्जिघ्नन्त आपथ्यो न पर्वतान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyayebhiḥ pavibhiḥ payovṛdha ujjighnanta āpathyo na parvatān |
Translation: 11 They who with golden fellies make the rain increase drive forward the big clouds like wanderers on the way.

Sanskit Text: मखा अयासः सवस्र्तो धरुवच्युतो दुध्रक्र्तो मरुतो भराजद्र्ष्टयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: makhā ayāsaḥ svasṛto dhruvacyuto dudhrakṛto maruto bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ ||
Translation: Self-moving, brisk, unwearied, they o’erthrow the firm; the Maruts with bright lances make all things to reel.

Sanskit Text: घर्षुं पावकं वनिनं विचर्षणिं रुद्रस्य सूनुं हवसा गर्णीमसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛṣuṃ pāvakaṃ vaninaṃ vicarṣaṇiṃ rudrasya sūnuṃ havasā ghṛṇīmasi |
Translation: 12 The progeny of Rudra we invoke with prayer, the brisk, the bright, the worshipful, the active Ones

Sanskit Text: रजस्तुरं तवसं मारुतं गणं रजीषिणंव्र्षणं सश्चत शरिये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rajasturaṃ tavasaṃ mārutaṃ ghaṇaṃ ṛjīṣiṇaṃvṛṣaṇaṃ saścata śriye ||
Translation: To the strong band of Maruts cleave for happiness, the chasers of the sky, impetuous, vigorous.

Sanskit Text: पर नू स मर्तः शवसा जनानति तस्थौ व ऊती मरुतो यमावत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra nū sa martaḥ śavasā janānati tasthau va ūtī maruto yamāvata |
Translation: 13 Maruts, the man whom ye have guarded with your help, he verily in strength surpasseth all mankind.

Sanskit Text: अर्वद्भिर्वजं भरते धना नर्भिराप्र्छ्यंक्रतुमा कषेति पुष्यति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvadbhirvajaṃ bharate dhanā nṛbhirāpṛchyaṃkratumā kṣeti puṣyati ||
Translation: Spoil with his steeds he gaineth, treasure with his men; he winneth honourable strength and prospereth.

Sanskit Text: चर्क्र्त्यं मरुतः पर्त्सु दुष्टरं दयुमन्तं शुष्मं मघवत्सु धत्तन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: carkṛtyaṃ marutaḥ pṛtsu duṣṭaraṃ dyumantaṃ śuṣmaṃ maghavatsu dhattana |
Translation: 14 O Maruts, to the worshippers give glorious strength invincible in battle, brilliant, bringing wealth,

Sanskit Text: धनस्प्र्तमुक्थ्यं विश्वचर्षणिं तोकं पुष्येम तनयं शतं हिमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhanaspṛtamukthyaṃ viśvacarṣaṇiṃ tokaṃ puṣyema tanayaṃ śataṃ himaḥ ||
Translation: Praiseworthy, known to all men. May we foster well, during a hundred winters, son and progeny.

Sanskit Text: नू षठिरं मरुतो वीरवन्तं रतीषाहं रयिमस्मासु धत्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū ṣṭhiraṃ maruto vīravantaṃ ṛtīṣāhaṃ rayimasmāsu dhatta |
Translation: 15 Will ye then, O ye Maruts, grant us riches, durable, rich in men, defying onslaught.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रिणं शतिनं शूशुवांसं परातर मक्षू धियावसुर जगम्यात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasriṇaṃ śatinaṃ śūśuvāṃsaṃ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasur jaghamyāt ||
Translation: A hundred, thousandfold, ever increasing? May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

Sanskit Text: पश्वा न तायुं गुहा चतन्तं नमो युजानं नमो वहन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: paśvā na tāyuṃ ghuhā catantaṃ namo yujānaṃ namo vahantam |
Translation: 1. ONE-MINDED, wise, they tracked thee like a thief lurking in dark cave with a stolen cow:

Sanskit Text: सजोषा धीराः पदैरनु गमन्नुप तवा सीदन विश्वेयजत्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣā dhīrāḥ padairanu ghmannupa tvā sīdan viśveyajatrāḥ ||
Translation: Thee claiming worship, bearing it to Gods: there nigh to thee sate all the Holy Ones.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य देवा अनु वरता गुर्भुवत परिष्टिर्द्यौर्न भूम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya devā anu vratā ghurbhuvat pariṣṭirdyaurna bhūma |
Translation: 2 The Gods approached the ways of holy Law; there was a gathering vast as heaven itself.

Sanskit Text: वर्धन्तीमापः पन्वा सुशिश्विं रतस्य योना गर्भे सुजातम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vardhantīmāpaḥ panvā suśiśviṃ ṛtasya yonā gharbhe sujātam ||
Translation: The waters feed with praise the growing Babe, born nobly in the womb, the seat of Law.

Sanskit Text: पुष्टिर्न रण्वा कषितिर्न पर्थिवी गिरिर्न भुज्म कषोदो न शम्भु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: puṣṭirna raṇvā kṣitirna pṛthivī ghirirna bhujma kṣodo na śambhu |
Translation: 3 Like grateful food, like some wide dwelling place, like a fruit-bearing hill, a wholesome stream.

Sanskit Text: अत्यो नाज्मन सर्गप्रतक्तः सिन्धुर्न कषोदः क ईं वराते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atyo nājman sarghaprataktaḥ sindhurna kṣodaḥ ka īṃ varāte ||
Translation: Like a steed urged to run in swift career, rushing like Sindhu, who may check his course?

Sanskit Text: जामिः सिन्धूनां भरातेव सवस्रामिभ्यान न राजा वनान्यत्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jāmiḥ sindhūnāṃ bhrāteva svasrāmibhyān na rājā vanānyatti |
Translation: 4 Kin as a brother to his sister floods, he eats the woods as a King eats the rich.

Sanskit Text: यद वातजूतो वना वयस्थादग्निर्ह दाति रोमा पर्थिव्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vātajūto vanā vyasthādaghnirha dāti romā pṛthivyāḥ ||
Translation: When through the forest, urged by wind, he spreads, verily Agni shears the hair of earth.

Sanskit Text: शवसित्यप्सु हंसो न सीदन करत्वा चेतिष्ठो विशामुषर्भुत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śvasityapsu haṃso na sīdan kratvā cetiṣṭho viśāmuṣarbhut |
Translation: 5 Like a swan sitting in the floods he pants wisest in mind mid men he wakes at morn.

Sanskit Text: सोमो न वेधा रतप्रजातः पशुर्न शिश्वा विभुर्दूरेभाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somo na vedhā ṛtaprajātaḥ paśurna śiśvā vibhurdūrebhāḥ ||
Translation: A Sage like Soma, sprung from Law, he grew like some young creature, mighty, shining far.

Sanskit Text: रयिर्न चित्रा सूरो न सन्द्र्गायुर्न पराणो नित्यो नसूनुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rayirna citrā sūro na sandṛghāyurna prāṇo nityo nasūnuḥ |
Translation: 1. LIKE the Sun's glance, like wealth of varied sort, like breath which is the life, like one's own son,

Sanskit Text: तक्वा न भूर्णिर्वना सिषक्ति पयो न धेनुः शुचिर्विभावा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: takvā na bhūrṇirvanā siṣakti payo na dhenuḥ śucirvibhāvā ||
Translation: Like a swift bird, a cow who yields her milk, pure and refulgent to the wood he speeds.

Sanskit Text: दाधार कषेममोको न रण्वो यवो न पक्वो जेता जनानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dādhāra kṣemamoko na raṇvo yavo na pakvo jetā janānām |
Translation: 2 He offers safety like a pleasant home, like ripened corn, the Conqueror of men.

Sanskit Text: रषिर्न सतुभ्वा विक्षु परशस्तो वाजी न परीतो वयोदधति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṣirna stubhvā vikṣu praśasto vājī na prīto vayodadhati ||
Translation: Like a Seer lauding, famed among the folk; like a steed friendly he vouchsafes us power.

Sanskit Text: दुरोकशोचिः करतुर्न नित्यो जायेव योनावरं विश्वस्मै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: durokaśociḥ kraturna nityo jāyeva yonāvaraṃ viśvasmai |
Translation: 3 With flame insatiate, like eternal might; caring for each one like a dame at home;

Sanskit Text: चित्रो यदभ्राट छवेतो न विक्षु रथो न रुक्मी तवेषः समत्सु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: citro yadabhrāṭ chveto na vikṣu ratho na rukmī tveṣaḥ samatsu ||
Translation: Bright when he shines forth, whitish mid the folk, like a car, gold-decked, thundering to the fight.

Sanskit Text: सेनेव सर्ष्टामं दधात्यस्तुर्न दिद्युत तवेषप्रतीका |
Sanskrit Transliteration: seneva sṛṣṭāmaṃ dadhātyasturna didyut tveṣapratīkā |
Translation: 4 He strikes with terror like a dart shot forth, e’en like an archer's arrow tipped with flame;

Sanskit Text: यमो ह जातो यमो जनित्वं जारः कनीनां पतिर्जनीनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamo ha jāto yamo janitvaṃ jāraḥ kanīnāṃ patirjanīnām ||
Translation: Master of present and of future life, the maidens’ lover and the matrons’ Lord.

Sanskit Text: तं वश्चराथा वयं वसत्यास्तं न गावो नक्षन्त इद्धम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vaścarāthā vayaṃ vasatyāstaṃ na ghāvo nakṣanta iddham |
Translation: 5 To him lead all your ways: may we attain the kindled God as cows their home at eve.

Sanskit Text: सिन्धुर्न कषोदः पर नीचीरैनोन नवन्त गावः सवर्द्र्शीके ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sindhurna kṣodaḥ pra nīcīrainon navanta ghāvaḥ svardṛśīke ||
Translation: He drives the flames below as floods their swell: the rays rise up to the fair place of heaven.

Sanskit Text: वनेषु जायुर्मर्तेषु मित्रो वर्णीते शरुष्टिं राजेवाजुर्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaneṣu jāyurmarteṣu mitro vṛṇīte śruṣṭiṃ rājevājuryam |
Translation: 1. VICTORIOUS in the wood, Friend among men, ever he claims obedience as a King.

Sanskit Text: कषेमो न साधुः करतुर्न भद्रो भुवत सवाधिर्होता हव्यवाट ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣemo na sādhuḥ kraturna bhadro bhuvat svādhirhotā havyavāṭ ||
Translation: Gracious like peace, blessing like mental power, Priest was he, offering-bearer, full of thought.

Sanskit Text: हस्ते दधानो नर्म्णा विश्वान्यमे देवान धाद गुहा निषीदन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: haste dadhāno nṛmṇā viśvānyame devān dhād ghuhā niṣīdan |
Translation: 2 He, bearing in his hand all manly might, crouched in the cavern, struck the Gods with fear.

Sanskit Text: विदन्तीमत्र नरो धियन्धा हर्दा यत तष्टान मन्त्रानशंसन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidantīmatra naro dhiyandhā hṛdā yat taṣṭān mantrānaśaṃsan ||
Translation: Men filled with understanding find him there, when they have sting prayers formed within their heart.

Sanskit Text: अजो न कषां दाधार पर्थिवीं तस्तम्भ दयां मन्त्रेभिः सत्यैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajo na kṣāṃ dādhāra pṛthivīṃ tastambha dyāṃ mantrebhiḥ satyaiḥ |
Translation: 3 He, like the Unborn, holds the broad earth up; and with effective utterance fixed the sky.

Sanskit Text: परिया पदानि पश्वो नि पाहि विश्वायुरग्ने गुहा गुहं गाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyā padāni paśvo ni pāhi viśvāyuraghne ghuhā ghuhaṃ ghāḥ ||
Translation: O Agni, guard the spots which cattle love: thou, life of all, hast gone from lair to lair.

Sanskit Text: य ईं चिकेत गुहा भवन्तमा यः ससाद धारां रतस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya īṃ ciketa ghuhā bhavantamā yaḥ sasāda dhārāṃ ṛtasya |
Translation: 4 Whoso hath known him dwelling in his lair, and hath approached the stream of holy Law,—

Sanskit Text: वि ये चर्तन्त्य रता सपन्त आदिद वसूनि पर ववाचास्मै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi ye cṛtanty ṛtā sapanta ādid vasūni pra vavācāsmai ||
Translation: They who release him, paying sacred rites,—truly to such doth he announce great wealth.

Sanskit Text: वि यो वीरुत्सु रोधन महित्वोत परजा उत परसूष्वन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yo vīrutsu rodhan mahitvota prajā uta prasūṣvantaḥ |
Translation: 5 He who grows mightily in herbs, within each fruitful mother and each babe she bears,

Sanskit Text: चित्तिरपां दमे विश्वायुः सद्मेव धीराः सम्माय चक्रुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cittirapāṃ dame viśvāyuḥ sadmeva dhīrāḥ sammāya cakruḥ ||
Translation: Wise, life of all men, in the waters’ home,—for him have sages built as ’twere a seat.

Sanskit Text: शरीणन्नुप सथाद दिवं भुरण्यु सथातुश्चरथमक्तून्व्यूर्णोत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrīṇannupa sthād divaṃ bhuraṇyu sthātuścarathamaktūnvyūrṇot |
Translation: 1. COMMINGLING, restless, he ascends the sky, unveiling nights and all that stands or moves,

Sanskit Text: परि यदेषामेको विश्वेषां भुवद देवो देवानां महित्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari yadeṣāmeko viśveṣāṃ bhuvad devo devānāṃ mahitvā ||
Translation: As he the sole God is preeminent in greatness among all these other Gods.

Sanskit Text: आदित ते विश्वे करतुं जुषन्त शुष्काद यद देव जीवो जनिष्ठाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādit te viśve kratuṃ juṣanta śuṣkād yad deva jīvo janiṣṭhāḥ |
Translation: 2 All men are joyful in thy power, O God, that living from the dry wood thou art born.

Sanskit Text: भजन्त विश्वे देवत्वं नाम रतं सपन्तो अम्र्तमेवैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhajanta viśve devatvaṃ nāma ṛtaṃ sapanto amṛtamevaiḥ ||
Translation: All truly share thy Godhead while they keep, in their accustomed ways, eternal Law.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य परेषा रतस्य धीतिर्विश्वायुर्विश्वे अपांसि चक्रुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya preṣā ṛtasya dhītirviśvāyurviśve apāṃsi cakruḥ |
Translation: 3 Strong is the thought of Law, the Law's behest; all works have they performed; he quickens all.

Sanskit Text: यस्तुभ्यं दाशाद यो वा ते शिक्षात तस्मै चिकित्वान्रयिं दयस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yastubhyaṃ dāśād yo vā te śikṣāt tasmai cikitvānrayiṃ dayasva ||
Translation: Whoso will bring oblation, gifts to thee, to him, bethinking thee, vouchsafe thou wealth.

Sanskit Text: होता निषत्तो मनोरपत्ये स चिन नवासां पती रयीणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotā niṣatto manorapatye sa cin nvāsāṃ patī rayīṇām |
Translation: 4 Seated as Priest with Manu's progeny, of all these treasures he alone is Lord.

Sanskit Text: इछन्त रेतो मिथस्तनूषु सं जानत सवैर्दक्षैरमूराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ichanta reto mithastanūṣu saṃ jānata svairdakṣairamūrāḥ ||
Translation: Men yearn for children to prolong their line, and are not disappointed in their hope.

Sanskit Text: पितुर्न पुत्राः करतुं जुषन्त शरोषन ये अस्य शासं तुरासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: piturna putrāḥ kratuṃ juṣanta śroṣan ye asya śāsaṃ turāsaḥ |
Translation: 5 Eagerly they who hear his word fulfil his wish as sons obey their sire's behest.

Sanskit Text: वि राय और्णोद दुरः पुरुक्षुः पिपेश नाकं सत्र्भिर्दमूनाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi rāya aurṇod duraḥ purukṣuḥ pipeśa nākaṃ stṛbhirdamūnāḥ ||
Translation: He, rich in food, unbars his wealth like doors: he, the House-Friend, hath decked heaven's vault with stars.

Sanskit Text: शुक्रः शुशुक्वानुषो न जारः पप्रा समीची दिवो नज्योतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śukraḥ śuśukvānuṣo na jāraḥ paprā samīcī divo najyotiḥ |
Translation: 1. BRIGHT, splendid, like Dawn's lover, he hath filled the two joined worlds as with the light of heaven.

Sanskit Text: परि परजातः करत्वा बभूथ भुवो देवानां पिता पुत्रः सन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari prajātaḥ kratvā babhūtha bhuvo devānāṃ pitā putraḥ san ||
Translation: When born, with might thou hast encompassed them: Father of Gods, and yet their Son wast thou.

Sanskit Text: वेधा अद्र्प्तो अग्निर्विजानन्नूधर्न गोनां सवाद्मा पितूनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vedhā adṛpto aghnirvijānannūdharna ghonāṃ svādmā pitūnām |
Translation: 2 Agni, the Sage, the humble, who discerns like the cow's udder, the sweet taste of food,

Sanskit Text: जने न शेव आहूर्यः सन मध्ये निषत्तो रण्वो दुरोणे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jane na śeva āhūryaḥ san madhye niṣatto raṇvo duroṇe ||
Translation: Like a bliss-giver to be drawn to men, sits gracious in the middle of the house.

Sanskit Text: पुत्रो न जातो रण्वो दुरोणे वाजी न परीतो विशो वि तारीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: putro na jāto raṇvo duroṇe vājī na prīto viśo vi tārīt |
Translation: 3 Born in the dwelling like a lovely son, pleased, like a strong steed, he bears on the folk.

Sanskit Text: विशो यदह्वे नर्भिः सनीळा अग्निर्देवत्वा विश्वान्यश्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśo yadahve nṛbhiḥ sanīḷā aghnirdevatvā viśvānyaśyāḥ ||
Translation: What time the men and I, with heroes, call, may Agni then gain all through Godlike power.

Sanskit Text: नकिष ट एता वरता मिनन्ति नर्भ्यो यदेभ्यः शरुष्टिं चकर्थ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nakiṣ ṭa etā vratā minanti nṛbhyo yadebhyaḥ śruṣṭiṃ cakartha |
Translation: 4 None breaks these holy laws of thine when thou hast granted audience to these chieftains here.

Sanskit Text: तत तु ते दंसो यदहन समानैर्न्र्भिर्यद युक्तो विवे रपांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat tu te daṃso yadahan samānairnṛbhiryad yukto vive rapāṃsi ||
Translation: This is thy boast, thou smotest with thy peers, and joined with heroes dravest off disgrace.

Sanskit Text: उषो न जारो विभावोस्रः संज्ञातरूपश्चिकेतदस्मै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣo na jāro vibhāvosraḥ saṃjñātarūpaściketadasmai |
Translation: 5 Like the Dawn's lover, spreading light, well-known as hued like morn, may he remember me.

Sanskit Text: तमना वहन्तो दुरो वय रण्वन नवन्त विश्वे सवर्द्र्शीके ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tmanā vahanto duro vy ṛṇvan navanta viśve svardṛśīke ||
Translation: They, bearing of themselves, unbar the doors: they all ascend to the fair place of heaven.

Sanskit Text: वनेम पूर्वीरर्यो मनीषा अग्निः सुशोको विश्वान्यश्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanema pūrvīraryo manīṣā aghniḥ suśoko viśvānyaśyāḥ |
Translation: 1. MAY we, the pious, win much food by prayer, may Agni with fair light pervade each act,—

Sanskit Text: आ दैव्यानि वरता चिकित्वाना मानुषस्य जनस्य जन्म ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā daivyāni vratā cikitvānā mānuṣasya janasya janma ||
Translation: He the observer of the heavenly laws of Gods, and of the race of mortal man.

Sanskit Text: गर्भो यो अपां गर्भो वनानां गर्भश्च सथातां गर्भश्चरथाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: gharbho yo apāṃ gharbho vanānāṃ gharbhaśca sthātāṃ gharbhaścarathām |
Translation: 2 He who is germ of waters, germ of woods, germ of all things that move not and that move,—

Sanskit Text: अद्रौ चिदस्मा अन्तर्दुरोणे विशां न विश्वो अम्र्तः सवाधीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adrau cidasmā antarduroṇe viśāṃ na viśvo amṛtaḥ svādhīḥ ||
Translation: To him even in the rock and in the house: Immortal One, he cares for all mankind.

Sanskit Text: स हि कषपावानग्नी रयीणां दाशद यो अस्मा अरं सूक्तैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi kṣapāvānaghnī rayīṇāṃ dāśad yo asmā araṃ sūktaiḥ |
Translation: 3 Agni is Lord of riches for the man who serves him readily with sacred songs.

Sanskit Text: एता चिकित्वो भूमा नि पाहि देवानां जन्म मर्तांश्च विद्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: etā cikitvo bhūmā ni pāhi devānāṃ janma martāṃśca vidvān ||
Translation: Protect these beings thou with careful thought, knowing the races both of Gods and men.

Sanskit Text: वर्धान यं पूर्वीः कषपो विरूपा सथातुश्च रथं रतप्रवीतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vardhān yaṃ pūrvīḥ kṣapo virūpā sthātuśca rathaṃ ṛtapravītam |
Translation: 4 Whom many dawns and nights, unlike, make strong, whom, born in Law, all things that move and stand,—

Sanskit Text: अराधि होता सवर्निषत्तः कर्ण्वन विश्वान्यपांसि सत्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arādhi hotā svarniṣattaḥ kṛṇvan viśvānyapāṃsi satyā ||
Translation: He hath been won, Herald who sits in light, making effectual all our holy works.

Sanskit Text: गोषु परशस्तिं वनेषु धिषे भरन्त विश्वे बलिं सवर्णः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghoṣu praśastiṃ vaneṣu dhiṣe bharanta viśve baliṃ svarṇaḥ |
Translation: 5 Thou settest value on our cows and woods: all shall bring tribute to us to the light.

Sanskit Text: वि तवा नरः पुरुत्रा सपर्यन पितुर्न जिव्रेर्वि वेदोभरन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi tvā naraḥ purutrā saparyan piturna jivrervi vedobharanta ||
Translation: Men have served thee in many and sundry spots, parting, as ’twere, an aged father's wealth.

Sanskit Text: साधुर्न गर्ध्नुरस्तेव शूरो यातेव भीमस्त्वेषः समत्सु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sādhurna ghṛdhnurasteva śūro yāteva bhīmastveṣaḥ samatsu ||
Translation: 6 Like a brave archer, like one skilled and bold, a fierce avenger, so he shines in fight.

Sanskit Text: उप पर जिन्वन्नुशतीरुशन्तं पतिं न नित्यं जनयः सनीळाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa pra jinvannuśatīruśantaṃ patiṃ na nityaṃ janayaḥ sanīḷāḥ |
Translation: 1. LOVING the loving One, as wives their husband, the sisters of one home have urged him forward,

Sanskit Text: सवसारः शयावीमरुषीमजुष्रञ्चित्रमुछन्तीमुषसं न गावः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svasāraḥ śyāvīmaruṣīmajuṣrañcitramuchantīmuṣasaṃ na ghāvaḥ ||
Translation: Bright-coloured, even, as the cows love morning, dark, breaking forth to view, and redly beaming.

Sanskit Text: वीळु चिद दर्ळ्हा पितरो न उक्थैरद्रिं रुजन्नङगिरसो रवेण |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vīḷu cid dṛḷhā pitaro na ukthairadriṃ rujannaṅghiraso raveṇa |
Translation: 2 Our sires with lauds burst e’en the firm-set fortress, yea, the Aṅgirases, with roar, the mountain.

Sanskit Text: चक्रुर्दिवो बर्हतो गातुमस्मे अहः सवर्विविदुः केतुमुस्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakrurdivo bṛhato ghātumasme ahaḥ svarvividuḥ ketumusrāḥ ||
Translation: They made for us a way to reach high heaven, they found us day, light, day's sign, beams of morning.

Sanskit Text: दधन्न्र्तं धनयन्नस्य धीतिमादिदर्यो दिधिष्वो विभ्र्त्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhannṛtaṃ dhanayannasya dhītimādidaryo didhiṣvo vibhṛtrāḥ |
Translation: 3 They stablished order, made his service fruitful; then parting them among the longing faithful,

Sanskit Text: अत्र्ष्यन्तीरपसो यन्त्यछा देवाञ जन्म परयसा वर्धयन्तीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atṛṣyantīrapaso yantyachā devāñ janma prayasā vardhayantīḥ ||
Translation: Not thirsting after aught, they come, most active, while with sweet food the race of Gods they strengthen.

Sanskit Text: मथीद यदीं विभ्र्तो मातरिश्वा गर्हे-गर्हे शयेतो जेन्यो भूत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mathīd yadīṃ vibhṛto mātariśvā ghṛhe-ghṛhe śyeto jenyo bhūt |
Translation: 4 Since Mātariśvan, far-diffused, hath stirred him, and he in every house grown bright and noble,

Sanskit Text: आदीं राज्ञे न सहीयसे सचा सन्ना दूत्यं भर्गवाणो विवाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādīṃ rājñe na sahīyase sacā sannā dūtyaṃ bhṛghavāṇo vivāya ||
Translation: He, Bhṛgu-like I hath gone as his companion, as on commission to a greater Sovran.

Sanskit Text: महे यत पित्र ईं रसं दिवे करव तसरत पर्शन्यश्चिकित्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahe yat pitra īṃ rasaṃ dive karava tsarat pṛśanyaścikitvān |
Translation: 5 When man poured juice to Heaven, the mighty Father, he knew and freed himself from close embracement.

Sanskit Text: सर्जदस्ता धर्षता दिद्युमस्मै सवायां देवो दुहितरि तविषिं धात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sṛjadastā dhṛṣatā didyumasmai svāyāṃ devo duhitari tviṣiṃ dhāt ||
Translation: The archer boldly shot at him his arrow, and the God threw his splendour on his Daughter.

Sanskit Text: सव आ यस्तुभ्यं दम आ विभाति नमो वा दाशादुशतो अनु दयून |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sva ā yastubhyaṃ dama ā vibhāti namo vā dāśāduśato anu dyūn |
Translation: 6 Whoso, hath flames for thee within his dwelling, or brings the worship which thou lovest daily,

Sanskit Text: वर्धो अग्ने वयो अस्य दविबर्हा यासद राया सरथं यं जुनासि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vardho aghne vayo asya dvibarhā yāsad rāyā sarathaṃ yaṃ junāsi ||
Translation: Do thou of double might increase his substance: may he whom thou incitest meet with riches.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं विश्वा अभि पर्क्षः सचन्ते समुद्रं न सरवतः सप्त यह्वीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ viśvā abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante samudraṃ na sravataḥ sapta yahvīḥ |
Translation: 7 All sacrificial viands wait on Agni as the Seven mighty Rivers seek the ocean.

Sanskit Text: न जामिभिर्वि चिकिते वयो नो विदा देवेषु परमतिं चिकित्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na jāmibhirvi cikite vayo no vidā deveṣu pramatiṃ cikitvān ||
Translation: Not by our brethren was our food discovered: find with the Gods care for us, thou who knowest.

Sanskit Text: आ यदिषे नर्पतिं तेज आनट छुचि रेतो निषिक्तं दयौरभीके |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yadiṣe nṛpatiṃ teja ānaṭ chuci reto niṣiktaṃ dyaurabhīke |
Translation: 8 When light hath filled the Lord of men for increase, straight from the heaven descends the limpid moisture.

Sanskit Text: अग्निः शर्धमनवद्यं युवानं सवाध्यं जनयत सूदयच्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniḥ śardhamanavadyaṃ yuvānaṃ svādhyaṃ janayat sūdayacca ||
Translation: Agni hath brought to light and filled with spirit the youthful host blameless and well providing.

Sanskit Text: मनो न यो.अध्वनः सद्य एत्येकः सत्रा सूरो वस्व ईशे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mano na yo.adhvanaḥ sadya etyekaḥ satrā sūro vasva īśe |
Translation: 9 He who like thought goes swiftly on his journey, the Sun, alone is ever Lord of riches.

Sanskit Text: राजाना मित्रावरुणा सुपाणी गोषु परियमम्र्तं रक्षमाणा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājānā mitrāvaruṇā supāṇī ghoṣu priyamamṛtaṃ rakṣamāṇā ||
Translation: The Kings with fair hands, Varuṇa and Mitra, protect the precious nectar in our cattle.
