Sanskit Text: मा नो अग्ने सख्या पित्र्याणि पर मर्षिष्ठा अभि विदुष कविः सन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no aghne sakhyā pitryāṇi pra marṣiṣṭhā abhi viduṣ kaviḥ san |
Translation: 10 O Agni, break not our ancestral friendship, Sage as thou art, endowed with deepest knowledge.

Sanskit Text: नभो न रूपं जरिमा मिनाति पुरा तस्या अभिशस्तेरधीहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nabho na rūpaṃ jarimā mināti purā tasyā abhiśasteradhīhi ||
Translation: Old age, like gathering cloud, impairs the body: before that evil be come nigh protect me.

Sanskit Text: नि काव्या वेधसः शश्वतस कर्हस्ते दधानो नर्या पुरूणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni kāvyā vedhasaḥ śaśvatas karhaste dadhāno naryā purūṇi |
Translation: 1. THOUGH holding many gifts for men, he humbleth the higher powers of each wise ordainer.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्भुवद रयिपती रयीणां सत्रा चक्राणो अम्र्तानि विश्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirbhuvad rayipatī rayīṇāṃ satrā cakrāṇo amṛtāni viśvā ||
Translation: Agni is now the treasure-lord of treasures, for ever granting all immortal bounties.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे वत्सं परि षन्तं न विन्दन्निछन्तो विश्वे अम्र्ता अमूराः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme vatsaṃ pari ṣantaṃ na vindannichanto viśve amṛtā amūrāḥ |
Translation: 2 The Gods infallible all searching found not him, the dear Babe who still is round about us.

Sanskit Text: शरमयुवः पदव्यो धियन्धास्तस्थुः पदे परमेचार्वग्नेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śramayuvaḥ padavyo dhiyandhāstasthuḥ pade paramecārvaghneḥ ||
Translation: Worn weary, following his track, devoted, they reached the lovely highest home of Agni.

Sanskit Text: तिस्रो यदग्ने शरदस्त्वामिच्छुचिं घर्तेन शुचयः सपर्यान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisro yadaghne śaradastvāmicchuciṃ ghṛtena śucayaḥ saparyān |
Translation: 3 Because with holy oil the pure Ones, Agni, served thee the very pure three autumn seasons,

Sanskit Text: नामानि चिद दधिरे यज्ञियान्यसूदयन्त तन्वः सुजाताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāmāni cid dadhire yajñiyānyasūdayanta tanvaḥ sujātāḥ ||
Translation: Therefore they won them holy names for worship, and nobly born they dignified their bodies.

Sanskit Text: आ रोदसी बर्हती वेविदानाः पर रुद्रिया जभ्रिरे यज्ञियासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā rodasī bṛhatī vevidānāḥ pra rudriyā jabhrire yajñiyāsaḥ |
Translation: 4 Making them known to spacious earth and heaven, the holy Ones revealed the powers of Rudra.

Sanskit Text: विदन मर्तो नेमधिता चिकित्वानग्निं पदे परमे तस्थिवांसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidan marto nemadhitā cikitvānaghniṃ pade parame tasthivāṃsam ||
Translation: The mortal band, discerning in the distance, found Agni standing in the loftiest station.

Sanskit Text: संजानाना उप सीदन्नभिज्ञु पत्नीवन्तो नमस्यं नमस्यन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃjānānā upa sīdannabhijñu patnīvanto namasyaṃ namasyan |
Translation: 5 Nigh they approached, one-minded, with their spouses, kneeling to him adorable paid worship.

Sanskit Text: रिरिक्वांसस्तन्वः कर्ण्वत सवाः सखा सख्युर्निमिषिरक्षमाणाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ririkvāṃsastanvaḥ kṛṇvata svāḥ sakhā sakhyurnimiṣirakṣamāṇāḥ ||
Translation: Friend finding in his own friend's eye protection, they made their own the bodies which they chastened.

Sanskit Text: तरिः सप्त यद गुह्यानि तवे इत पदाविदन निहिता यज्ञियासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: triḥ sapta yad ghuhyāni tve it padāvidan nihitā yajñiyāsaḥ |
Translation: 6 Soon as the holy beings had discovered the thrice-seven mystic things contained within thee,

Sanskit Text: तेभी रक्षन्ते अम्र्तं सजोषाः पशूञ्च सथातॄञ्चरथं च पाहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tebhī rakṣante amṛtaṃ sajoṣāḥ paśūñca sthātṝñcarathaṃ ca pāhi ||
Translation: With these, one-minded, they preserve the Amṛta: guard thou the life of all their plants and cattle.

Sanskit Text: विद्वानग्ने वयुनानि कषितीनां वयानुषक छुरुधो जीवसेधाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidvānaghne vayunāni kṣitīnāṃ vyānuṣak churudho jīvasedhāḥ |
Translation: 7 Thou, Agni, knower of men's works, hast sent us good food in constant course for our subsistence:

Sanskit Text: अन्तर्विद्वानध्वनो देवयानानतन्द्रो दूतो अभवो हविर्वाट ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: antarvidvānadhvano devayānānatandro dūto abhavo havirvāṭ ||
Translation: Thou deeply skilled in paths of Gods becamest an envoy never wearied, offering-bearer.

Sanskit Text: सवाध्यो दिव आ सप्त यह्वी रायो दुरो वय रतज्ञा अजानन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svādhyo diva ā sapta yahvī rāyo duro vy ṛtajñā ajānan |
Translation: 8 Knowing the Law, the seven strong floods from heaven, full of good thought, discerned the doors of riches.

Sanskit Text: विदद गव्यं सरमा दर्ळ्हमूर्वं येना नु कं मानुषीभोजते विट ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidad ghavyaṃ saramā dṛḷhamūrvaṃ yenā nu kaṃ mānuṣībhojate viṭ ||
Translation: Saramā found the cattle's firm-built prison whereby the race of man is still supported.

Sanskit Text: आ ये विश्वा सवपत्यानि तस्थुः कर्ण्वानासो अम्र्तत्वाय गातुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ye viśvā svapatyāni tasthuḥ kṛṇvānāso amṛtatvāya ghātum |
Translation: 9 They who approached all noble operations making a path that leads to life immortal,

Sanskit Text: मह्ना महद्भिः पर्थिवी वि तस्थे माता पुत्रैरदितिर्धायसे वेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahnā mahadbhiḥ pṛthivī vi tasthe mātā putrairaditirdhāyase veḥ ||
Translation: To be the Bird's support, the spacious mother, Aditi, and her great Sons stood in power.

Sanskit Text: अधि सरियं नि दधुश्चारुमस्मिन दिवो यदक्षी अम्र्ता अक्र्ण्वन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi sriyaṃ ni dadhuścārumasmin divo yadakṣī amṛtā akṛṇvan |
Translation: 10 When Gods immortal made both eyes of heaven, they gave to him the gift of beauteous glory.

Sanskit Text: अध कषरन्ति सिन्धवो न सर्ष्टाः पर नी चीरग्नेरुषीरजानन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha kṣaranti sindhavo na sṛṣṭāḥ pra nī cīraghnearuṣīrajānan ||
Translation: Now they flow forth like rivers set in motion: they knew the Red Steeds coming down, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: रयिर्न यः पित्र्वित्तो वयोधाः सुप्रणीतिश्चिकितुषो नशासुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rayirna yaḥ pitṛvitto vayodhāḥ supraṇītiścikituṣo naśāsuḥ |
Translation: 1. HE who gives food, like patrimonial riches and guides aright like some wise man's instruction,

Sanskit Text: सयोनाशीरतिथिर्न परीणानो होतेव सद्म विधतो वि तारीत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: syonāśīratithirna prīṇāno hoteva sadma vidhato vi tārīt ||
Translation: Loved like a guest who lies in pleasant lodging,—may he, as Priest, prosper his servant's dwelling.

Sanskit Text: देवो न यः सविता सत्यमन्मा करत्वा निपाति वर्जनानि विश्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devo na yaḥ savitā satyamanmā kratvā nipāti vṛjanāni viśvā |
Translation: 2 He who like Savitar the God, true-minded protecteth with his power. all acts of vigour,

Sanskit Text: पुरुप्रशस्तो अमतिर्न सत्य आत्मेव शेवो दिधिषाय्यो भूत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purupraśasto amatirna satya ātmeva śevo didhiṣāyyo bhūt ||
Translation: Truthful, like splendour, glorified by many, like breath joy-giving,—all must strive to win him.

Sanskit Text: देवो न यः पर्थिवीं विश्वधाया उपक्षेति हितमित्रो न राजा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devo na yaḥ pṛthivīṃ viśvadhāyā upakṣeti hitamitro na rājā |
Translation: 3 He who on earth dwells like a king surrounded by faithful friends, like a God all-sustaining,

Sanskit Text: पुरःसदः शर्मसदो न वीरा अनवद्या पतिजुष्टेव नारी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: puraḥsadaḥ śarmasado na vīrā anavadyā patijuṣṭeva nārī ||
Translation: Like heroes who preside, who sit in safety: like as a blameless dame dear to her husband.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा नरो दम आ नित्यमिद्धमग्ने सचन्त कषितिषु धरुवासु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā naro dama ā nityamiddhamaghne sacanta kṣitiṣu dhruvāsu |
Translation: 4 Thee, such, in settlements secure, O Agni, our men serve ever kindled in each dwelling.

Sanskit Text: अधि दयुम्नं नि दधुर्भूर्यस्मिन भवा विश्वायुर्धरुणो रयीणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi dyumnaṃ ni dadhurbhūryasmin bhavā viśvāyurdharuṇo rayīṇām ||
Translation: On him have they laid splendour in abundance: dear to all men, bearer be he of riches.

Sanskit Text: वि पर्क्षो अग्ने मघवानो अश्युर्वि सूरयो ददतो विश्वमायुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi pṛkṣo aghne maghavāno aśyurvi sūrayo dadato viśvamāyuḥ |
Translation: 5 May thy rich worshippers win food, O Agni, and princes gain long life who bring oblation.

Sanskit Text: सनेम वाजं समिथेष्वर्यो भागं देवेषु शरवसेदधानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanema vājaṃ samitheṣvaryo bhāghaṃ deveṣu śravasedadhānāḥ ||
Translation: May we get booty from our foe in battle, presenting to the Gods their share for glory.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य हि धेनवो वावशानाः समदूध्नीः पीपयन्त दयुभक्ताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya hi dhenavo vāvaśānāḥ smadūdhnīḥ pīpayanta dyubhaktāḥ |
Translation: 6 The cows of holy law, sent us by Heaven, have swelled with laden udders, loudly lowing;

Sanskit Text: परावतः सुमतिं भिक्षमाणा वि सिन्धवः समया सस्रुरद्रिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parāvataḥ sumatiṃ bhikṣamāṇā vi sindhavaḥ samayā sasruradrim ||
Translation: Soliciting his favour, from a distance the rivers to the rock have flowed together.

Sanskit Text: तवे अग्ने सुमतिं भिक्षमाणा दिवि शरवो दधिरे यज्ञियासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve aghne sumatiṃ bhikṣamāṇā divi śravo dadhire yajñiyāsaḥ |
Translation: 7 Agni, with thee, soliciting thy favour, the holy Ones have gained glory in heaven.

Sanskit Text: नक्ता च चक्रुरुषसा विरूपे कर्ष्णं च वर्णमरुणं च सं धुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: naktā ca cakruruṣasā virūpe kṛṣṇaṃ ca varṇamaruṇaṃ ca saṃ dhuḥ ||
Translation: They made the Night and Dawn of different colours, and set the black and purple hues together.

Sanskit Text: यान राये मर्तान सुषूदो अग्ने ते सयाम मघवानो वयं च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yān rāye martān suṣūdo aghne te syāma maghavāno vayaṃ ca |
Translation: 8 May we and those who worship be the mortals whom thou, O Agni, leadest on to riches.

Sanskit Text: छायेव विश्वं भुवनं सिसक्ष्यापप्रिवान रोदसी अन्तरिक्षम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: chāyeva viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃ sisakṣyāpaprivān rodasī antarikṣam ||
Translation: Thou hast filled earth and heaven and air's mid-region, and followest the whole world like a shadow.

Sanskit Text: अर्वद्भिरग्ने अर्वतो नर्भिर्नॄन वीरैर्वीरान वनुयामा तवोताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvadbhiraghne arvato nṛbhirnṝn vīrairvīrān vanuyāmā tvotāḥ |
Translation: 9 Aided by thee, O Agni, may we conquer steeds with steeds, men with men, heroes with heroes,

Sanskit Text: ईशानासः पित्र्वित्तस्य रायो वि सूरयः शतहिमा नो अश्युः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: īśānāsaḥ pitṛvittasya rāyo vi sūrayaḥ śatahimā no aśyuḥ ||
Translation: Lords of the wealth transmitted by our fathers: and may our princes live a hundred winters.

Sanskit Text: एता ते अग्न उचथानि वेधो जुष्टानि सन्तु मनसे हर्दे च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etā te aghna ucathāni vedho juṣṭāni santu manase hṛde ca |
Translation: 10 May these our hymns of praise, Agni, Ordainer, be pleasant to thee in thy heart and spirit.

Sanskit Text: शकेम रायः सुधुरो यमं ते.अधि शरवो देवभक्तं दधानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śakema rāyaḥ sudhuro yamaṃ te.adhi śravo devabhaktaṃ dadhānāḥ ||
Translation: May we have power to hold thy steeds of riches, laying on thee the God-sent gift of glory.

Sanskit Text: जुषस्व सप्रथस्तमं वचो देवप्सरस्तमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣasva saprathastamaṃ vaco devapsarastamam |
Translation: 1. ACCEPT our loudest-sounding hymn, food most delightful to the Gods,

Sanskit Text: हव्या जुह्वानासनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: havyā juhvānaāsani ||
Translation: Pouring our offerings in thy mouth.

Sanskit Text: अथा ते अङगिरस्तमाग्ने वेधस्तम परियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā te aṅghirastamāghne vedhastama priyam |
Translation: 2 Now, Agni, will we say to thee, O wisest and best Aṅgiras,

Sanskit Text: वोचेम बरह्म सानसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vocema brahma sānasi ||
Translation: Our precious, much-availing prayer.

Sanskit Text: कस्ते जामिर्जनानामग्ने को दाश्वध्वरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaste jāmirjanānāmaghne ko dāśvadhvaraḥ |
Translation: 3 Who, Agni, is thy kin, of men? who is thy worthy worshipper?

Sanskit Text: को ह कस्मिन्नसि शरितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko ha kasminnasi śritaḥ ||
Translation: On whom dependent? who art thou?

Sanskit Text: तवं जामिर्जनानामग्ने मित्रो असि परियः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ jāmirjanānāmaghne mitro asi priyaḥ |
Translation: 4 The kinsman, Agni, of mankind, their well beloved Friend art thou,

Sanskit Text: सखा सखिभ्य ईड्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhā sakhibhya īḍyaḥ ||
Translation: A Friend whom friends may supplicate.

Sanskit Text: यजा नो मित्रावरुणा यजा देवान रतं बर्हत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajā no mitrāvaruṇā yajā devān ṛtaṃ bṛhat |
Translation: 5 Bring to us Mitra, Varuṇa, bring the Gods to mighty sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने यक्षिस्वं दमम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne yakṣisvaṃ damam ||
Translation: Bring them, O Agni, to thine home.

Sanskit Text: का त उपेतिर्मनसो वराय भुवदग्ने शन्तमा का मनीषा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kā ta upetirmanaso varāya bhuvadaghne śantamā kā manīṣā |
Translation: 1. How may the mind draw nigh to please thee, Agni? What hymn of praise shall bring us greatest blessing?

Sanskit Text: को वा यज्ञैः परि दक्षं त आप केन वा ते मनसादाशेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko vā yajñaiḥ pari dakṣaṃ ta āpa kena vā te manasādāśema ||
Translation: Or who hath gained thy power by sacrifices? or with what mind shall we bring thee oblations?

Sanskit Text: एह्यग्न इह होता नि षीदादब्धः सु पुरेता भवा नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ehyaghna iha hotā ni ṣīdādabdhaḥ su puraetā bhavā naḥ |
Translation: 2 Come hither, Agni; sit thee down as Hotar; be thou who never wast deceived our leader.

Sanskit Text: अवतां तवा रोदसी विश्वमिन्वे यजा महे सौमनसाय देवान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avatāṃ tvā rodasī viśvaminve yajā mahe saumanasāya devān ||
Translation: May Heaven and Earth, the all-pervading, love thee: worship the Gods to win for us their favour.

Sanskit Text: पर सु विश्वान रक्षसो धक्ष्यग्ने भवा यज्ञानामभिशस्तिपावा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra su viśvān rakṣaso dhakṣyaghne bhavā yajñānāmabhiśastipāvā |
Translation: 3 Burn thou up all the Rākṣasas, O Agni; ward thou off curses from our sacrifices.

Sanskit Text: अथा वह सोमपतिं हरिभ्यामातिथ्यमस्मै चक्र्मा सुदाव्ने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā vaha somapatiṃ haribhyāmātithyamasmai cakṛmā sudāvne ||
Translation: Bring hither with his Bays the Lord of Soma: here is glad welcome for the Bounteous Giver.

Sanskit Text: परजावता वचसा वह्निरासा च हुवे नि च सत्सीह देवैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prajāvatā vacasā vahnirāsā ca huve ni ca satsīha devaiḥ |
Translation: 4 Thou Priest with lip and voice that bring us children hast been invoked. Here with the Gods be seated.

Sanskit Text: वेषि होत्रमुत पोत्रं यजत्र बोधि परयन्तर्जनितर्वसूनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: veṣi hotramuta potraṃ yajatra bodhi prayantarjanitarvasūnām ||
Translation: Thine is the task of Cleanser and Presenter: waken us, Wealth-bestower and Producer.

Sanskit Text: यथा विप्रस्य मनुषो हविर्भिर्देवानयजः कविभिः कविः सन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā viprasya manuṣo havirbhirdevānayajaḥ kavibhiḥ kaviḥ san |
Translation: 5 As with oblations of the priestly Manus thou worshippedst the Gods, a Sage with sages,

Sanskit Text: एवा होतः सत्यतर तवमद्याग्ने मन्द्रया जुह्वा यजस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā hotaḥ satyatara tvamadyāghne mandrayā juhvā yajasva ||
Translation: So now, O truthfullest Invoker Agni, worship this day with joy-bestowing ladle.

Sanskit Text: कथा दाशेमाग्नये कास्मै देवजुष्टोच्यते भामिने गीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kathā dāśemāghnaye kāsmai devajuṣṭocyate bhāmine ghīḥ |
Translation: 1. How shall we pay oblation unto Agni? What hymn, Godloved, is said to him refulgent?

Sanskit Text: यो मर्त्येष्वम्र्त रतावा होता यजिष्ठ इत कर्णोति देवान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo martyeṣvamṛta ṛtāvā hotā yajiṣṭha it kṛṇoti devān ||
Translation: Who, deathless, true to Law, mid men a herald, bringeth the Gods as best of sacrificers?

Sanskit Text: यो अध्वरेषु शन्तम रतावा होता तमू नमोभिरा कर्णुध्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo adhvareṣu śantama ṛtāvā hotā tamū namobhirā kṛṇudhvam |
Translation: 2 Bring him with reverence hither, most propitious in sacrifices, true to Law, the herald;

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्यद वेर्मर्ताय देवान स चा बोधाति मनसायजाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniryad vermartāya devān sa cā bodhāti manasāyajāti ||
Translation: For Agni, when he seeks the Gods for mortals, knows them full well and worships them in spirit.

Sanskit Text: स हि करतुः स मर्यः स साधुर्मित्रो न भूदद्भुतस्य रथीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi kratuḥ sa maryaḥ sa sādhurmitro na bhūdadbhutasya rathīḥ |
Translation: 3 For he is mental power, a man, and perfect; he is the bringer, friend-like, of the wondrous.

Sanskit Text: तं मेधेषु परथमं देवयन्तीर्विश उप बरुवते दस्ममारीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ medheṣu prathamaṃ devayantīrviśa upa bruvate dasmamārīḥ ||
Translation: The pious Āryan tribes at sacrifices address them first to him who doeth marvels.

Sanskit Text: स नो नर्णां नर्तमो रिशाद अग्निर्गिरो.अवसा वेतु धीतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no nṛṇāṃ nṛtamo riśāda aghnirghiro.avasā vetu dhītim |
Translation: 4 May Agni, foe-destroyer, manliest Hero, accept with love our hymns and our devotion.

Sanskit Text: तना च ये मघवानः शविष्ठ वाजप्रसूता इषयन्तमन्म ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tanā ca ye maghavānaḥ śaviṣṭha vājaprasūtā iṣayantamanma ||
Translation: So may the liberal lords whose strength is strongest, urged by their riches, stir our thoughts with vigour.

Sanskit Text: एवाग्निर्गोतमेभिर्र्तावा विप्रेभिरस्तोष्ट जातवेदाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evāghnirghotamebhirṛtāvā viprebhirastoṣṭa jātavedāḥ |
Translation: 5 Thus Agni Jātavedas, true to Order, hath by the priestly Gotamas been lauded.

Sanskit Text: स एषु दयुम्नं पीपयत स वाजं स पुष्टिं याति जोषमा चिकित्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa eṣu dyumnaṃ pīpayat sa vājaṃ sa puṣṭiṃ yāti joṣamā cikitvān ||
Translation: May he augment in them splendour and vigour: observant, as he lists, he gathers increase.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यकेशो रजसो विसारे.अहिर्धुनिर्वात इव धरजीमान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyakeśo rajaso visāre.ahirdhunirvāta iva dhrajīmān |
Translation: 1. HE in mid-air's expanse hath golden tresses; a raging serpent, like the rushing tempest:

Sanskit Text: शुचिभ्राजा उषसो नवेदा यशस्वतीरपस्युवो न सत्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śucibhrājā uṣaso navedā yaśasvatīrapasyuvo na satyāḥ ||
Translation: Purely refulgent, knowing well the morning; like honourable dames, true, active workers.

Sanskit Text: आ ते सुपर्णा अमिनन्तमेवैः कर्ष्णो नोनाव वर्षभो यदीदम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā te suparṇā aminantamevaiḥ kṛṣṇo nonāva vṛṣabho yadīdam |
Translation: 2 Thy well-winged flashes strengthen in their manner, when the black Bull hath bellowed round about us.

Sanskit Text: शिवाभिर्न समयमानाभिरागात पतन्ति मिहः सतनयन्त्यभ्रा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śivābhirna smayamānābhirāghāt patanti mihaḥ stanayantyabhrā ||
Translation: With drops that bless and seem to smile he cometh: the waters fall, the clouds utter their thunder.

Sanskit Text: यदीं रतस्य पयसा पियानो नयन्न्र्तस्य पथिभी रजिष्ठैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadīṃ ṛtasya payasā piyāno nayannṛtasya pathibhī rajiṣṭhaiḥ |
Translation: 3 When he comes streaming with the milk of worship, conducting by directest paths of Order

Sanskit Text: अर्यमा मित्रो वरुनः परिज्मा तवचं पर्ञ्चन्त्युपरस्य योनौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aryamā mitro varunaḥ parijmā tvacaṃ pṛñcantyuparasya yonau ||
Translation: Aryaman, Mitra, Varuṇa, Parijman fill the hide full where lies the nether press-stone.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने वाजस्य गोमत ईशानः सहसो यहो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne vājasya ghomata īśānaḥ sahaso yaho |
Translation: 4 O Agni, thou who art the lord of wealth in kine, thou Son of Strength,

Sanskit Text: अस्मे धेहि जातवेदो महि शरवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme dhehi jātavedo mahi śravaḥ ||
Translation: Vouchsafe to us, O Jātavedas, high renown.

Sanskit Text: स इधनो वसुष कविरग्निरीळेन्यो गिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa idhano vasuṣ kaviraghnirīḷenyo ghirā |
Translation: 5 He, Agni, kindled, good and wise, must be exalted in our song:

Sanskit Text: रेवदस्मभ्यम्पुर्वणीक दीदिहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: revadasmabhyampurvaṇīka dīdihi ||
Translation: Shine, thou of many forms, shine radiantly on us.

Sanskit Text: कषपो राजन्नुत तमनाग्ने वस्तोरुतोषसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣapo rājannuta tmanāghne vastorutoṣasaḥ |
Translation: 6 O Agni, shining of thyself by night and when the morning breaks,

Sanskit Text: स तिग्मजम्भ रक्षसो दह परति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tighmajambha rakṣaso daha prati ||
Translation: Burn, thou whose teeth are sharp, against the Rākṣasas.

Sanskit Text: अवा नो अग्न ऊतिभिर्गायत्रस्य परभर्मणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avā no aghna ūtibhirghāyatrasya prabharmaṇi |
Translation: 7 Adorable in all our rites, favour us, Agni, with thine aid,

Sanskit Text: विश्वासु धीषु वन्द्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāsu dhīṣu vandya ||
Translation: When the great hymn is chanted forth.

Sanskit Text: आ नो अग्ने रयिं भर सत्रासाहं वरेण्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no aghne rayiṃ bhara satrāsāhaṃ vareṇyam |
Translation: 8 Bring to us ever-conquering wealth, wealth, Agni, worthy of our choice,

Sanskit Text: विश्वासु पर्त्सुदुष्टरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāsu pṛtsuduṣṭaram ||
Translation: In all our frays invincible.

Sanskit Text: आ नो अग्ने सुचेतुना रयिं विश्वायुपोषसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no aghne sucetunā rayiṃ viśvāyupoṣasam |
Translation: 9 Give us, O Agni, through thy grace wealth that supporteth all our life,

Sanskit Text: मार्डीकं धेहि जीवसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mārḍīkaṃ dhehi jīvase ||
Translation: Thy favour so that we may live.

Sanskit Text: पर पूतास्तिग्मशोचिषे वाचो गोतमाग्नये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra pūtāstighmaśociṣe vāco ghotamāghnaye |
Translation: 10 O Gotama, desiring bliss present thy songs composed with care

Sanskit Text: भरस्व सुम्नयुर्गिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharasva sumnayurghiraḥ ||
Translation: To Agni of the pointed flames.

Sanskit Text: यो नो अग्ने.अभिदासत्यन्ति दूरे पदीष्ट सः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo no aghne.abhidāsatyanti dūre padīṣṭa saḥ |
Translation: 11 May the man fall, O Agni, who near or afar assaileth us:

Sanskit Text: अस्माकमिद वर्धे भव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākamid vṛdhe bhava ||
Translation: Do thou increase and prosper us.

Sanskit Text: सहस्राक्षो विचर्षणिरग्नी रक्षांसि सेधति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasrākṣo vicarṣaṇiraghnī rakṣāṃsi sedhati |
Translation: 12 Keen and swift Agni, thousand-eyed, chaseth the Rākṣasas afar:

Sanskit Text: होता गर्णीत उक्थ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotā ghṛṇīta ukthyaḥ ||
Translation: He singeth, herald meet for lauds.

Sanskit Text: इत्था हि सोम इन मदे बरह्मा चकार वर्धनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: itthā hi soma in made brahmā cakāra vardhanam |
Translation: 1. THUS in the Soma, in wild joy the Brahman hath exalted thee:

Sanskit Text: शविष्ठ वज्रिन्नोजसा पर्थिव्या निः शशा अहिमर्चन्ननु सवराज्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaviṣṭha vajrinnojasā pṛthivyā niḥ śaśā ahimarcannanu svarājyam ||
Translation: Thou, mightiest thunder-armed, hast driven by force the Dragon from the earth, lauding thine own imperial sway.

Sanskit Text: स तवामदद वर्षा मदः सोमः शयेनाभ्र्तः सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvāmadad vṛṣā madaḥ somaḥ śyenābhṛtaḥ sutaḥ |
Translation: 2 The mighty flowing Soma-draught, brought by the Hawk, hath gladdened thee,

Sanskit Text: येनाव्र्त्रं निरद्भ्यो जघन्थ वज्रिन्नोजसार्चन्न... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenāvṛtraṃ niradbhyo jaghantha vajrinnojasārcann... ||
Translation: That in thy strength, O Thunderer, thou hast struck down Vṛtra from the floods, lauding thine own imperial sway.

Sanskit Text: परेह्यभीहि धर्ष्णुहि न ते वज्रो नि यंसते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prehyabhīhi dhṛṣṇuhi na te vajro ni yaṃsate |
Translation: 3 Go forward, meet the foe, be bold; thy bolt of thunder is not checked.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र नर्म्णं हि ते शवो हनो वर्त्रं जया अपो.अर्चन्न... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra nṛmṇaṃ hi te śavo hano vṛtraṃ jayā apo.arcann... ||
Translation: Manliness, Indra, is thy might: stay Vṛtra, make the waters thine, lauding thine own imperial sway.

Sanskit Text: निरिन्द्र भूम्या अधि वर्त्रं जघन्थ निर्दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nirindra bhūmyā adhi vṛtraṃ jaghantha nirdivaḥ |
Translation: 4 Thou smotest Vṛtra from the earth, smotest him, Indra, from the sky.

Sanskit Text: सर्जा मरुत्वतीरव जीवधन्या इमा अपो.अर्चन्न... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sṛjā marutvatīrava jīvadhanyā imā apo.arcann... ||
Translation: Let these life-fostering waters flow attended by the Marut host, lauding thine own imperial sway.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो वर्त्रस्य दोधतः सानुं वज्रेण हीळितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro vṛtrasya dodhataḥ sānuṃ vajreṇa hīḷitaḥ |
Translation: 5 The wrathful Indra with his bolt of thunder rushing on the foe,

Sanskit Text: अभिक्रम्याव जिघ्नते.अपः सर्माय चोदयन्नर्चन्न... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhikramyāva jighnate.apaḥ sarmāya codayannarcann... ||
Translation: Smote fierce on trembling Vṛtra's back, and loosed the waters free to run, lauding his own imperial sway.

Sanskit Text: अधि सानौ नि जिघ्नते वज्रेण शतपर्वणा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi sānau ni jighnate vajreṇa śataparvaṇā |
Translation: 6 With hundred-jointed thunderbolt Indra hath struck him on the back,

Sanskit Text: मन्दान इन्द्रो अन्धसः सखिभ्यो गातुमिछत्यर्चन्न... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mandāna indro andhasaḥ sakhibhyo ghātumichatyarcann... ||
Translation: And, while rejoicing in the juice, seeketh prosperity for friends, lauding his own imperial sway.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र तुभ्यमिदद्रिवो.अनुत्तं वज्रिन वीर्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra tubhyamidadrivo.anuttaṃ vajrin vīryam |
Translation: 7 Indra, unconquered might is thine, Thunderer, Caster of the Stone;

Sanskit Text: यद ध तयम्मायिनं मर्गं तमु तवं माययावधीरर्चन्न... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad dha tyammāyinaṃ mṛghaṃ tamu tvaṃ māyayāvadhīrarcann... ||
Translation: For thou with thy surpassing power smotest to death the guileful beast, lauding thine own imperial sway.

Sanskit Text: वि ते वज्रासो अस्थिरन नवतिं नाव्या अनु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi te vajrāso asthiran navatiṃ nāvyā anu |
Translation: 8 Far over ninety spacious floods thy thunderbolts were cast abroad:

Sanskit Text: महत त इन्द्र वीर्यं बाह्वोस्ते बलं हितमर्चन्न... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahat ta indra vīryaṃ bāhvoste balaṃ hitamarcann... ||
Translation: Great, Indra, is thy hero might, and strength is seated in thine arms, lauding thine own imperial sway.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रं साकमर्चत परि षटोभत विंशतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasraṃ sākamarcata pari ṣṭobhata viṃśatiḥ |
Translation: 9 Laud him a thousand all at once, shout twenty forth the hymn of praise.

Sanskit Text: शतैनमन्वनोनवुरिन्द्राय बरह्मोद्यतमर्चन्न... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śatainamanvanonavurindrāya brahmodyatamarcann... ||
Translation: Hundreds have sung aloud to him, to Indra hath the prayer been raised, lauding his own imperial sway.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो वर्त्रस्य तविषीं निरहन सहसा सहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro vṛtrasya taviṣīṃ nirahan sahasā sahaḥ |
Translation: 10 Indra hath smitten down the power of Vṛtra,—might with stronger might.

Sanskit Text: महत तदस्य पौंस्यं वर्त्रं जघन्वानस्र्जदर्चन्न... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahat tadasya pauṃsyaṃ vṛtraṃ jaghanvānasṛjadarcann... ||
Translation: This was his manly exploit, he slew Vṛtra and let loose the floods, lauding his own imperial sway.

Sanskit Text: इमे चित तव मन्यवे वेपेते भियसा मही |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime cit tava manyave vepete bhiyasā mahī |
Translation: 11 Yea, even this great Pair of Worlds trembled in terror at thy wrath,

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्र वज्रिन्नोजसा वर्त्रं मरुत्वानवधीरर्चन्न... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindra vajrinnojasā vṛtraṃ marutvānavadhīrarcann... ||
Translation: When, Indra, Thunderer, Marut-girt, thou slewest Vṛtra in thy strength, lauding thine own imperial sway.

Sanskit Text: न वेपसा न तन्यतेन्द्रं वर्त्रो वि बीभयत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na vepasā na tanyatendraṃ vṛtro vi bībhayat |
Translation: 12 But Vṛtra scared not Indra with his shaking or his thunder roar.

Sanskit Text: अभ्येनं वज्र आयसः सहस्रभ्र्ष्टिरायतार्चन्न... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhyenaṃ vajra āyasaḥ sahasrabhṛṣṭirāyatārcann... ||
Translation: On him that iron thunderbolt fell fiercely with its thousand points, lauding his own imperial sway.

Sanskit Text: यद वर्त्रं तव चशनिं वज्रेण समयोधयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vṛtraṃ tava caśaniṃ vajreṇa samayodhayaḥ |
Translation: 13 When with the thunder thou didst make thy dart and Vṛtra meet in war,

Sanskit Text: अहिमिन्द्रजिघांसतो दिवि ते बद्बधे शवो.अर्चन्न... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahimindrajighāṃsato divi te badbadhe śavo.arcann... ||
Translation: Thy might, O Indra, fain to slay the Dragon, was set firm in heaven, lauding thine own imperial sway.

Sanskit Text: अभिष्टने ते अद्रिवो यत सथा जगच्च रेजते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhiṣṭane te adrivo yat sthā jaghacca rejate |
Translation: 14 When at thy shout, O Thunder-armed, each thing both fixed and moving shook,

Sanskit Text: तवष्टा चित तव मन्यव इन्द्र वेविज्यते भियार्चन्न... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṣṭā cit tava manyava indra vevijyate bhiyārcann... ||
Translation: E’en Tvaṣṭar trembled at thy wrath and quaked with fear because of thee, lauding thine own imperial sway.

Sanskit Text: नहि नु यादधीमसीन्द्रं को वीर्या परः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi nu yādadhīmasīndraṃ ko vīryā paraḥ |
Translation: 15 There is not, in our knowledge, one who passeth Indra in his strength:

Sanskit Text: तस्मिन नर्म्णमुत करतुं देवा ओजांसि सं दधुरर्चन्न... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmin nṛmṇamuta kratuṃ devā ojāṃsi saṃ dadhurarcann... ||
Translation: In him the Deities have stored manliness, insight, power and might, lauding his own imperial sway.

Sanskit Text: यमथर्व मनुष पिता दध्यं धियमत्नत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamatharva manuṣ pitā dadhyaṃ dhiyamatnata |
Translation: 16 Still as of old, whatever rite Atharvan, Manus sire of all,

Sanskit Text: तस्मिन बरह्माणि पुर्वथेन्द्र उक्था समग्मतार्चन्न... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmin brahmāṇi purvathendra ukthā samaghmatārcann... ||
Translation: Dadhyach performed, their prayer and praise united in that Indra meet, lauding his own imperial sway.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो मदाय वाव्र्धे शवसे वर्त्रहा नर्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro madāya vāvṛdhe śavase vṛtrahā nṛbhiḥ |
Translation: 1. THE men have lifted Indra up, the Vṛtra slayer, to joy and strength:

Sanskit Text: तमिन महत्स्वाजिषूतेमर्भे हवामहे स वाजेषु पर नो.अविषत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamin mahatsvājiṣūtemarbhe havāmahe sa vājeṣu pra no.aviṣat ||
Translation: Him, verily, we invocate in battles whether great or small: be he our aid in deeds of might.

Sanskit Text: असि हि वीर सेन्यो.असि भूरि पराददिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asi hi vīra senyo.asi bhūri parādadiḥ |
Translation: 2 Thou, Hero, art a warrior, thou art giver of abundant spoil.

Sanskit Text: असि दभ्रस्य चिद्व्र्धो यजमानाय शिक्षसि सुन्वते भूरि ते वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asi dabhrasya cidvṛdho yajamānāya śikṣasi sunvate bhūri te vasu ||
Translation: Strengthening e’en the feeble, thou aidest the sacrificer, thou givest the offerer ample wealth.

Sanskit Text: यदुदीरत आजयो धर्ष्णवे धीयते धना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadudīrata ājayo dhṛṣṇave dhīyate dhanā |
Translation: 3 When war and battles are on foot, booty is laid before the bold.

Sanskit Text: युक्ष्वा मदच्युता हरी कं हनः कं वसौ दधो.अस्मानिन्द्र वसौ दधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yukṣvā madacyutā harī kaṃ hanaḥ kaṃ vasau dadho.asmānindra vasau dadhaḥ ||
Translation: Yoke thou thy wildly-rushing Bays. Whom wilt thou slay and whom enrich? Do thou, O Indra, make us rich.

Sanskit Text: करत्वामहाननुष्वधं भीम आ वाव्र्धे शवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratvāmahānanuṣvadhaṃ bhīma ā vāvṛdhe śavaḥ |
Translation: 4 Mighty through wisdom, as he lists, terrible, he hath waxed in strength.

Sanskit Text: शरियर्ष्व उपाकयोर्नि शिप्री हरिवान दधे हस्तयोर्वज्रमायसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śriyaṛṣva upākayorni śiprī harivān dadhe hastayorvajramāyasam ||
Translation: Lord of Bay Steeds, strong-jawed, sublime, he in joined hands for glory's sake hath grasped his iron thunderbolt.

Sanskit Text: आ पप्रौ पार्थिवं रजो बद्बधे रोचना दिवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā paprau pārthivaṃ rajo badbadhe rocanā divi |
Translation: 5 He filled the earthly atmosphere and pressed against the lights in heaven.

Sanskit Text: न तवावानिन्द्र कश्चन न जातो न जनिष्यते.अति विश्वं ववक्षिथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na tvāvānindra kaścana na jāto na janiṣyate.ati viśvaṃ vavakṣitha ||
Translation: None like thee ever hath been born, none, Indra, will be born like thee. Thou hast waxed mighty over all.

Sanskit Text: यो अर्यो मर्तभोजनं पराददाति दाशुषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo aryo martabhojanaṃ parādadāti dāśuṣe |
Translation: 6 May he who to the offerer gives the foeman's man-sustaining food,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो अस्मभ्यंशिक्षतु वि भजा भूरि ते वसु भक्षीय तव राधसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro asmabhyaṃśikṣatu vi bhajā bhūri te vasu bhakṣīya tava rādhasaḥ ||
Translation: May Indra lend his aid to us. Deal forth—abundant is thy wealth—that in thy bounty I may share.

Sanskit Text: मदे-मदे हि नो ददिर्यूथा गवां रजुक्रतुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: made-made hi no dadiryūthā ghavāṃ ṛjukratuḥ |
Translation: 7 He, righteous-hearted, at each time of rapture gives us herds of kine.

Sanskit Text: सं गर्भायपुरू शतोभयाहस्त्या वसु शिशीहि राय आ भर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ ghṛbhāyapurū śatobhayāhastyā vasu śiśīhi rāya ā bhara ||
Translation: Gather in both thy hands for us treasures of many hundred sorts. Sharpen thou us, and bring us wealth.

Sanskit Text: मादयस्व सुते सचा शवसे शूर राधसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mādayasva sute sacā śavase śūra rādhase |
Translation: 8 Refresh thee, Hero, with the juice outpoured for bounty and for strength.

Sanskit Text: विद्मा हि तवापुरूवसुमुप कामान सस्र्ज्महे.अथा नो.अविता भव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidmā hi tvāpurūvasumupa kāmān sasṛjmahe.athā no.avitā bhava ||
Translation: We know thee Lord of ample store, to thee have sent our hearts' desires: be therefore our Protector thou.

Sanskit Text: एते त इन्द्र जन्तवो विश्वं पुष्यन्ति वार्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete ta indra jantavo viśvaṃ puṣyanti vāryam |
Translation: 9 These people, Indra, keep for thee all that is worthy of thy choice.

Sanskit Text: अन्तर्हि खयोजनानामर्यो वेदो अदाशुषां तेषां नो वेद आ भर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: antarhi khyojanānāmaryo vedo adāśuṣāṃ teṣāṃ no veda ā bhara ||
Translation: Discover thou, as Lord, the wealth of men who offer up no gifts: bring thou to us this wealth of theirs.

Sanskit Text: उपो षु शर्णुही गिरो मघवन मातथा इव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upo ṣu śṛṇuhī ghiro maghavan mātathā iva |
Translation: 1. GRACIOUSLY listen to our songs, Maghavan, be not negligent.

Sanskit Text: यदा नः सून्र्तावतः कर आदर्थयास इद योजा नविन्द्र ते हरी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā naḥ sūnṛtāvataḥ kara ādarthayāsa id yojā nvindra te harī ||
Translation: As thou hast made us full of joy and lettest us solicit thee, now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

Sanskit Text: अक्षन्नमीमदन्त हयव परिया अधूषत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: akṣannamīmadanta hyava priyā adhūṣata |
Translation: 2 Well have they eaten and rejoiced; the friends have risen and passed away.

Sanskit Text: अस्तोषत सवभानवो विप्रा नविष्ठया मती योजा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: astoṣata svabhānavo viprā naviṣṭhayā matī yojā ... ||
Translation: The sages luminous in themselves have. praised thee with their latest hymn. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

Sanskit Text: सुसन्द्र्शं तवा वयं मघवन वन्दिषीमहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: susandṛśaṃ tvā vayaṃ maghavan vandiṣīmahi |
Translation: 3 Maghavan, we will reverence thee who art so fair to look upon.

Sanskit Text: पर नूनं पूर्णवन्धुर सतुतो याहि वशाननु योजा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra nūnaṃ pūrṇavandhura stuto yāhi vaśānanu yojā ... ||
Translation: Thus praised, according to our wish come now with richly laden car. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

Sanskit Text: स घा तं वर्षणं रथमधि तिष्ठाति गोविदम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ghā taṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rathamadhi tiṣṭhāti ghovidam |
Translation: 4 He will in very truth ascend the powerful car that finds the kine,

Sanskit Text: यःपात्रं हारियोजनं पूर्णमिन्द्र चिकेतति योजा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥpātraṃ hāriyojanaṃ pūrṇamindra ciketati yojā ... ||
Translation: Who thinks upon the well-filled bowl, the Tawny Coursers' harnesser. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

Sanskit Text: युक्तस्ते अस्तु दक्षिण उत सव्यः शतक्रतो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuktaste astu dakṣiṇa uta savyaḥ śatakrato ||
Translation: 5 Let, Lord of Hundred Powers, thy Steeds be harnessed on the right and left.

Sanskit Text: तेन जायामुप परियां मन्दानो याह्यन्धसो योजा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tena jāyāmupa priyāṃ mandāno yāhyandhaso yojā ... ||
Translation: Therewith in rapture of the juice, draw near to thy beloved Spouse. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

Sanskit Text: युनज्मि ते बरह्मणा केशिना हरी उप पर याहि दधिषे गभस्त्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yunajmi te brahmaṇā keśinā harī upa pra yāhi dadhiṣe ghabhastyoḥ |
Translation: 6 With holy prayer I yoke thy long-maned pair of Bays: come hitherward; thou holdest them in both thy hands.

Sanskit Text: उत तवा सुतासो रभसा अमन्दिषुः पूषण्वान वज्रिन समु पत्न्यामदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut tvā sutāso rabhasā amandiṣuḥ pūṣaṇvān vajrin samu patnyāmadaḥ ||
Translation: The stirring draughts of juice outpoured have made thee glad: thou, Thunderer, hast rejoiced with Pūṣan and thy Spouse.

Sanskit Text: अश्वावति परथमो गोषु गछति सुप्रावीरिन्द्र मर्त्यस्तवोतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvāvati prathamo ghoṣu ghachati suprāvīrindra martyastavotibhiḥ |
Translation: 1. INDRA, the mortal man well guarded by thine aid goes foremost in the wealth of horses and of kine.

Sanskit Text: तमित पर्णक्षि वसुना भवीयसा सिन्धुमापो यथाभितो विचेतसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamit pṛṇakṣi vasunā bhavīyasā sindhumāpo yathābhito vicetasaḥ ||
Translation: With amplest wealth thou fillest him, as round about the waters clearly seen afar fill Sindhu full.

Sanskit Text: आपो न देवीरुप यन्ति होत्रियमवः पश्यन्ति विततं यथा रजः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpo na devīrupa yanti hotriyamavaḥ paśyanti vitataṃ yathā rajaḥ |
Translation: 2 The heavenly Waters come not nigh the priestly bowl: they but look down and see how far mid-air is spread:

Sanskit Text: पराचैर्देवासः पर णयन्ति देवयुं बरह्मप्रियं जोषयन्ते वरा इव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prācairdevāsaḥ pra ṇayanti devayuṃ brahmapriyaṃ joṣayante varā iva ||
Translation: The Deities conduct the pious man to them: like suitors they delight in him who loveth prayer.

Sanskit Text: अधि दवयोरदधा उक्थ्यं वचो यतस्रुचा मिथुना या सपर्यतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi dvayoradadhā ukthyaṃ vaco yatasrucā mithunā yā saparyataḥ |
Translation: 3 Praiseworthy blessing hast thou laid upon the pair who with uplifted ladle serve thee, man and wife.

Sanskit Text: असंयत्तो वरते ते कषेति पुष्यति भद्रा शक्तिर्यजमानाय सुन्वते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asaṃyatto vrate te kṣeti puṣyati bhadrā śaktiryajamānāya sunvate ||
Translation: Unchecked he dwells and prospers in thy law: thy power brings blessing to the sacrificer pouring gifts.

Sanskit Text: आदङगिराः परथमं दधिरे वय इद्धाग्नयः शम्या येसुक्र्त्यया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādaṅghirāḥ prathamaṃ dadhire vaya iddhāghnayaḥ śamyā yesukṛtyayā |
Translation: 4 First the Aṅgirases won themselves vital power, whose fires were kindled through good deeds and sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: सर्वं पणेः समविन्दन्त भोजनमश्वावन्तं गोमन्तमा पशुं नरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarvaṃ paṇeḥ samavindanta bhojanamaśvāvantaṃ ghomantamā paśuṃ naraḥ ||
Translation: The men together found the Paṇi's hoarded wealth, the cattle, and the wealth in horses and in kine.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञैरथर्वा परथमः पथस्तते ततः सूर्यो वरतपावेन आजनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñairatharvā prathamaḥ pathastate tataḥ sūryo vratapāvena ājani |
Translation: 5 Atharvan first by sacrifices laid the paths then, guardian of the Law, sprang up the loving Sun.

Sanskit Text: आ गा आजदुशना काव्यः सचा यमस्य जातमम्र्तं यजामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ghā ājaduśanā kāvyaḥ sacā yamasya jātamamṛtaṃ yajāmahe ||
Translation: Uśanā Kāvya straightway hither drove the kine. Let us with offerings honour Yama's deathless birth.

Sanskit Text: बर्हिर्वा यत सवपत्याय वर्ज्यते.अर्को वा शलोकमाघोषतेदिवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: barhirvā yat svapatyāya vṛjyate.arko vā ślokamāghoṣatedivi |
Translation: 6 When sacred grass is trimmed to aid the auspicious work, or the hymn makes its voice of praise sound to the sky.

Sanskit Text: गरावा यत्र वदति कारुरुक्थ्यस्तस्येदिन्द्रो अभिपित्वेषु रण्यति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghrāvā yatra vadati kārurukthyastasyedindro abhipitveṣu raṇyati ||
Translation: Where the stone rings as ’twere a singer skilled in laud,—Indra in truth delights when these come near to him.

Sanskit Text: पर ये शुम्भन्ते जनयो न सप्तयो यामन रुद्रस्य सूनवःसुदंससः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ye śumbhante janayo na saptayo yāman rudrasya sūnavaḥsudaṃsasaḥ |
Translation: 1. THEY who are glancing forth, like women, on their way, doers of mighty deeds, swift racers, Rudra's Sons,

Sanskit Text: रोदसी हि मरुतश्चक्रिरे वर्धे मदन्ति वीरा विदथेषु घर्ष्वयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rodasī hi marutaścakrire vṛdhe madanti vīrā vidatheṣu ghṛṣvayaḥ ||
Translation: The Maruts have made heaven and earth increase and grow: in sacrifices they delight, the strong and wild.

Sanskit Text: त उक्षितासो महिमानमाशत दिवि रुद्रासो अधि चक्रिरे सदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta ukṣitāso mahimānamāśata divi rudrāso adhi cakrire sadaḥ |
Translation: 2 Grown to their perfect strength greatness have they attained; the Rudras have established their abode in heaven.

Sanskit Text: अर्चन्तो अर्कं जनयन्त इन्द्रियमधि शरियो दधिरे पर्श्निमातरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arcanto arkaṃ janayanta indriyamadhi śriyo dadhire pṛśnimātaraḥ ||
Translation: Singing their song of praise and generating might, they have put glory on, the Sons whom Pṛśni bare.

Sanskit Text: गोमातरो यच्छुभयन्ते अञ्जिभिस्तनूषु शुभ्रा दधिरे विरुक्मतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghomātaro yacchubhayante añjibhistanūṣu śubhrā dadhire virukmataḥ |
Translation: 3 When, Children of the Cow, they shine in bright attire, and on their fair limbs lay their golden ornaments,

Sanskit Text: बाधन्ते विश्वमभिमातिनमप वर्त्मान्येषामनु रीयते घर्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bādhante viśvamabhimātinamapa vartmānyeṣāmanu rīyate ghṛtam ||
Translation: They drive away each adversary from their path, and, following their traces, fatness floweth down,

Sanskit Text: वि ये भराजन्ते सुमखास रष्टिभिः परच्यावयन्तो अच्युताचिदोजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi ye bhrājante sumakhāsa ṛṣṭibhiḥ pracyāvayanto acyutācidojasā |
Translation: 4 When, mighty Warriors, ye who glitter with your spears, o’erthrowing with your strength e’en what is ne’er o’erthrown,

Sanskit Text: मनोजुवो यन मरुतो रथेष्वा वर्षव्रातासः पर्षतीरयुग्ध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manojuvo yan maruto ratheṣvā vṛṣavrātāsaḥ pṛṣatīrayughdhvam ||
Translation: When, O ye Maruts, ye the host that send the rain, had harnessed to your cars the thought-fleet spotted deer.

Sanskit Text: पर यद रथेषु पर्षतीरयुग्ध्वं वाजे अद्रिं मरुतो रंहयन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yad ratheṣu pṛṣatīrayughdhvaṃ vāje adriṃ maruto raṃhayantaḥ |
Translation: 5 When ye have harnessed to your cars the spotted deer, urging the thunderbolt, O Maruts, to the fray,

Sanskit Text: उतारुषस्य वि षयन्ति धाराश्चर्मेवोदभिर्व्युन्दन्ति भूम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utāruṣasya vi ṣyanti dhārāścarmevodabhirvyundanti bhūma ||
Translation: Forth rush the torrents of the dark red stormy cloud, and moisten, like a skin, the earth with water-floods.

Sanskit Text: आ वो वहन्तु सप्तयो रघुष्यदो रघुपत्वानः पर जिगात बाहुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vo vahantu saptayo raghuṣyado raghupatvānaḥ pra jighāta bāhubhiḥ |
Translation: 6 Let your swift-gliding coursers bear you hitherward with their fleet pinions. Come ye forward with your arms.

Sanskit Text: सीदता बर्हिरुरु वः सदस कर्तं मादयध्वं मरुतो मध्वो अन्धसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sīdatā barhiruru vaḥ sadas kṛtaṃ mādayadhvaṃ maruto madhvo andhasaḥ ||
Translation: Sit on the grass; a wide seat hath been made for you: delight yourselves, O Maruts, in the pleasant food.

Sanskit Text: ते.अवर्धन्त सवतवसो महित्वना नाकं तस्थुरुरु चक्रिरे सदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te.avardhanta svatavaso mahitvanā nākaṃ tasthururu cakrire sadaḥ |
Translation: 7 Strong in their native strength to greatness have they grown, stepped to the firmament and made their dwelling wide.

Sanskit Text: विष्णुर्यद धावद वर्षणं मदच्युतं वयो न सीदन्नधि बर्हिषि परिये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viṣṇuryad dhāvad vṛṣaṇaṃ madacyutaṃ vayo na sīdannadhi barhiṣi priye ||
Translation: When Viṣṇu saved the Soma bringing wild delight, the Maruts sate like birds on their dear holy grass.

Sanskit Text: शूरा इवेद युयुधयो न जग्मयः शरवस्यवो न पर्तनासु येतिरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śūrā ived yuyudhayo na jaghmayaḥ śravasyavo na pṛtanāsu yetire |
Translation: 8 In sooth like heroes fain for fight they rush about, like combatants fame-seeking have they striven in war.

Sanskit Text: भयन्ते विश्वा भुवना मरुद्भ्यो राजान इव तवेषसन्द्र्शो नरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhayante viśvā bhuvanā marudbhyo rājāna iva tveṣasandṛśo naraḥ ||
Translation: Before the Maruts every creature is afraid: the men are like to Kings, terrible to behold.

Sanskit Text: तवष्टा यद वज्रं सुक्र्तं हिरण्ययं सहस्रभ्र्ष्टिं सवपा अवर्तयत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṣṭā yad vajraṃ sukṛtaṃ hiraṇyayaṃ sahasrabhṛṣṭiṃ svapā avartayat |
Translation: 9 When Tvaṣṭar deft of hand had turned the thunderbolt, golden, with thousand edges, fashioned more skilfully,

Sanskit Text: धत्त इन्द्रो नर्यपांसि कर्तवे.अहन वर्त्रं निरपामौब्जदर्णवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhatta indro naryapāṃsi kartave.ahan vṛtraṃ nirapāmaubjadarṇavam ||
Translation: Indra received it to perform heroic deeds. Vṛtra he slew, and forced the flood of water forth.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वं नुनुद्रे.अवतं त ओजसा दद्र्हाणं चिद बिभिदुर्विपर्वतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvaṃ nunudre.avataṃ ta ojasā dadṛhāṇaṃ cid bibhidurviparvatam |
Translation: 10 They with their vigorous strength pushed the well up on high, and clove the cloud in twain though it was passing strong.

Sanskit Text: धमन्तो वाणं मरुतः सुदानवो मदे सोमस्य रण्यानि चक्रिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhamanto vāṇaṃ marutaḥ sudānavo made somasya raṇyāni cakrire ||
Translation: The Maruts, bounteous Givers, sending forth their voice, in the wild joy of Soma wrought their glorious deeds.

Sanskit Text: जिह्मं नुनुद्रे.अवतं तया दिशासिञ्चन्नुत्सं गोतमाय तर्ष्णजे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jihmaṃ nunudre.avataṃ tayā diśāsiñcannutsaṃ ghotamāya tṛṣṇaje |
Translation: 11 They drave the cloud transverse directed hitherward, and poured the fountain forth for thirsting Gotama.

Sanskit Text: आ गछन्तीमवसा चित्रभानवः कामं विप्रस्यतर्पयन्त धामभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ghachantīmavasā citrabhānavaḥ kāmaṃ viprasyatarpayanta dhāmabhiḥ ||
Translation: Shining with varied light they come to him with help: they with their might fulfilled the longing of the sage.

Sanskit Text: या वः शर्म शशमानाय सन्ति तरिधातूनि दाशुषे यछताधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā vaḥ śarma śaśamānāya santi tridhātūni dāśuṣe yachatādhi |
Translation: 12 The shelters which ye have for him who lauds you, bestow them threefold on the man who offers.

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं तानि मरुतो वि यन्त रयिं नो धत्त वर्षणः सुवीरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ tāni maruto vi yanta rayiṃ no dhatta vṛṣaṇaḥ suvīram ||
Translation: Extend the same boons unto us, ye Maruts. Give us, O Heroes, wealth with noble offspring.

Sanskit Text: मरुतो यस्य हि कषये पाथा दिवो विमहसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: maruto yasya hi kṣaye pāthā divo vimahasaḥ |
Translation: 1. THE best of guardians hath that man within whose dwelling place ye drink,

Sanskit Text: स सुगोपातमो जनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sughopātamo janaḥ ||
Translation: O Maruts, giants of the sky.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञैर्वा यज्ञवाहसो विप्रस्य वा मतीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñairvā yajñavāhaso viprasya vā matīnām |
Translation: 2 Honoured with sacrifice or with the worship of the sages’ hymns,

Sanskit Text: मरुतः शर्णुता हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: marutaḥ śṛṇutā havam ||
Translation: O Maruts, listen to the call.

Sanskit Text: उत वा यस्य वाजिनो.अनु विप्रमतक्षत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta vā yasya vājino.anu vipramatakṣata |
Translation: 3 Yea, the strong man to whom ye have vouchsafed to give a sage, shall move

Sanskit Text: स गन्ता गोमतिव्रजे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ghantā ghomativraje ||
Translation: Into a stable rich in kine.

Sanskit Text: अस्य वीरस्य बर्हिषि सुतः सोमो दिविष्टिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya vīrasya barhiṣi sutaḥ somo diviṣṭiṣu |
Translation: 4 Upon this hero's sacred grass Soma is poured in daily rites:

Sanskit Text: उक्थं मदश्च शस्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukthaṃ madaśca śasyate ||
Translation: Praise and delight are sung aloud.

Sanskit Text: अस्य शरोषन्त्वा भुवो विश्वा यश्चर्षणीरभि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya śroṣantvā bhuvo viśvā yaścarṣaṇīrabhi |
Translation: 5 Let the strong Maruts hear him, him surpassing all men: strength be his

Sanskit Text: सूरं चित सस्रुषीरिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūraṃ cit sasruṣīriṣaḥ ||
Translation: That reaches even to the Sun.

Sanskit Text: पूर्वीभिर्हि ददाशिम शरद्भिर्मरुतो वयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvībhirhi dadāśima śaradbhirmaruto vayam |
Translation: 6 For, through the swift Gods’ loving help, in many an autumn, Maruts, we

Sanskit Text: अवोभिश्चर्षणीनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avobhiścarṣaṇīnām ||
Translation: Have offered up our sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: सुभगः स परयज्यवो मरुतो अस्तु मर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: subhaghaḥ sa prayajyavo maruto astu martyaḥ |
Translation: 7 Fortunate shall that mortal be, O Maruts most adorable,

Sanskit Text: यस्य परयांसिपर्षथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya prayāṃsiparṣatha ||
Translation: Whose offerings ye bear away.

Sanskit Text: शशमानस्य वा नरः सवेदस्य सत्यशवसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaśamānasya vā naraḥ svedasya satyaśavasaḥ |
Translation: 8 O Heroes truly strong, ye know the toil of him who sings your praise,

Sanskit Text: विदा कामस्यवेनतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidā kāmasyavenataḥ ||
Translation: The heart's desire of him who loves.

Sanskit Text: यूयं तत सत्यशवस आविष कर्त महित्वना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyaṃ tat satyaśavasa āviṣ karta mahitvanā |
Translation: 9 O ye of true strength, make this thing manifest by your greatness: strike

Sanskit Text: विध्यता विद्युता रक्षः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidhyatā vidyutā rakṣaḥ ||
Translation: The demon with your thunderbolt.

Sanskit Text: गूहता गुह्यं तमो वि यात विश्वमत्रिणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghūhatā ghuhyaṃ tamo vi yāta viśvamatriṇam |
Translation: 10 Conceal the horrid darkness, drive far from us each devouring fiend.

Sanskit Text: जयोतिष कर्ता यदुश्मसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyotiṣ kartā yaduśmasi ||
Translation: Create the light for which we long.

Sanskit Text: परत्वक्षसः परतवसो विरप्शिनो.अनानता अविथुरा रजीषिणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratvakṣasaḥ pratavaso virapśino.anānatā avithurā ṛjīṣiṇaḥ |
Translation: 1. LOUD Singers, never humbled, active, full of strength, immovable, impetuous, manliest, best-beloved,

Sanskit Text: जुष्टतमासो नर्तमासो अञ्जिभिर्व्यानज्रे के चिदुस्रा इव सत्र्भिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣṭatamāso nṛtamāso añjibhirvyānajre ke cidusrā iva stṛbhiḥ ||
Translation: They have displayed themselves with glittering ornaments, a few in number only, like the heavens with stars.

Sanskit Text: उपह्वरेषु यदचिध्वं ययिं वय इव मरुतः केन चित पथा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upahvareṣu yadacidhvaṃ yayiṃ vaya iva marutaḥ kena cit pathā |
Translation: 2 When, Maruts, on the steeps ye pile the moving cloud, ye are like birds on whatsoever path it be.

Sanskit Text: शचोतन्ति कोशा उप वो रथेष्वा घर्तमुक्षता मधुवर्णमर्चते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ścotanti kośā upa vo ratheṣvā ghṛtamukṣatā madhuvarṇamarcate ||
Translation: Clouds everywhere shed forth the rain upon your cars. Drop fatness, honey-hued, for him who sings your praise.

Sanskit Text: परैषामज्मेषु विथुरेव रेजते भूमिर्यामेषु यद ध युञ्जते शुभे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: praiṣāmajmeṣu vithureva rejate bhūmiryāmeṣu yad dha yuñjate śubhe |
Translation: 3 Earth at their racings trembles as if weak and worn, when on their ways they yoke their cars for victory.

Sanskit Text: ते करीळयो धुनयो भराजद्र्ष्टयः सवयं महित्वं पनयन्त धूतयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te krīḷayo dhunayo bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ svayaṃ mahitvaṃ panayanta dhūtayaḥ ||
Translation: They, sportive, loudly roaring, armed with glittering spears, shakers of all, themselves admire their mightiness.

Sanskit Text: स हि सवस्र्त पर्षदश्वो युवा गणो.अया ईशानस्तविषीभिराव्र्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi svasṛt pṛṣadaśvo yuvā ghaṇo.ayā īśānastaviṣībhirāvṛtaḥ |
Translation: 4 Self-moving is that youthful band, with spotted steeds; thus it hath lordly sway, endued with power and might.

Sanskit Text: असि सत्य रणयावानेद्यो.अस्या धियः पराविताथा वर्षा गणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asi satya ṛṇayāvānedyo.asyā dhiyaḥ prāvitāthā vṛṣā ghaṇaḥ ||
Translation: Truthful art thou, and blameless, searcher out of sin: so thou, Strong Host, wilt be protector of this prayer.

Sanskit Text: पितुः परत्नस्य जन्मना वदामसि सोमस्य जिह्वा पर जिगाति चक्षसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pituḥ pratnasya janmanā vadāmasi somasya jihvā pra jighāti cakṣasā |
Translation: 5 We speak by our descent from our primeval Sire; our tongue, when we behold the Soma, stirs itself.

Sanskit Text: यदीमिन्द्रं शम्य रक्वाण आशतादिन नामानि यज्ञियानि दधिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadīmindraṃ śamy ṛkvāṇa āśatādin nāmāni yajñiyāni dadhire ||
Translation: When, shouting, they had joined Indra in toil of fight, then only they obtained their sacrificial names.

Sanskit Text: शरियसे कं भानुभिः सं मिमिक्षिरे ते रश्मिभिस्त रक्वभिः सुखादयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śriyase kaṃ bhānubhiḥ saṃ mimikṣire te raśmibhista ṛkvabhiḥ sukhādayaḥ |
Translation: 6 Splendours they gained for glory, they who wear bright rings; rays they obtained, and men to celebrate their praise.

Sanskit Text: ते वाशीमन्त इष्मिणो अभीरवो विद्रे परियस्य मारुतस्य धाम्नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te vāśīmanta iṣmiṇo abhīravo vidre priyasya mārutasya dhāmnaḥ ||
Translation: Armed with their swords, impetuous and fearing naught, they have possessed the Maruts’ own beloved home.

Sanskit Text: आ विद्युन्मद्भिर्मरुतः सवर्कै रथेभिर्यात रष्टिमद्भिरश्वपर्णैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vidyunmadbhirmarutaḥ svarkai rathebhiryāta ṛṣṭimadbhiraśvaparṇaiḥ |
Translation: 1. COME hither, Maruts, on your lightning laden cars, sounding with sweet songs, armed with lances, winged with steeds.

Sanskit Text: आ वर्षिष्ठया न इषा वयो न पप्तता सुमायाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā varṣiṣṭhayā na iṣā vayo na paptatā sumāyāḥ ||
Translation: Fly unto us with noblest food, like birds, O ye of mighty power.

Sanskit Text: ते.अरुणेभिर्वरमा पिशङगैः शुभे कं यान्ति रथतूर्भिरश्वैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te.aruṇebhirvaramā piśaṅghaiḥ śubhe kaṃ yānti rathatūrbhiraśvaiḥ |
Translation: 2 With their red-hued or, haply, tawny coursers which speed their chariots on, they come for glory.

Sanskit Text: रुक्मो न चित्रः सवधितीवान पव्या रथस्य जङघनन्त भूम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rukmo na citraḥ svadhitīvān pavyā rathasya jaṅghananta bhūma ||
Translation: Brilliant like gold is he who holds the thunder. Earth have they smitten with the chariot's felly.

Sanskit Text: शरिये कं वो अधि तनूषु वाशीर्मेधा वना न कर्णवन्त ऊर्ध्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śriye kaṃ vo adhi tanūṣu vāśīrmedhā vanā na kṛṇavanta ūrdhvā |
Translation: 3 For beauty ye have swords upon your bodies. As they stir woods so may they stir our spirits.

Sanskit Text: युष्मभ्यं कं मरुतः सुजातास्तुविद्युम्नासो धनयन्ते अद्रिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmabhyaṃ kaṃ marutaḥ sujātāstuvidyumnāso dhanayante adrim ||
Translation: For your sake, O ye Maruts very mighty and well-born, have they set the stone, in motion.

Sanskit Text: अहानि गर्ध्राः पर्या व आगुरिमां धियं वार्कार्यांच देवीम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahāni ghṛdhrāḥ paryā va āghurimāṃ dhiyaṃ vārkāryāṃca devīm |
Translation: 4 The days went round you and came back O yearners, back, to this prayer and to this solemn worship.

Sanskit Text: बरह्म कर्ण्वन्तो गोतमासो अर्कैरूर्ध्वं नुनुद्रौत्सधिं पिबध्यै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahma kṛṇvanto ghotamāso arkairūrdhvaṃ nunudrautsadhiṃ pibadhyai ||
Translation: The Gotamas making their prayer with singing have pushed the well's lid up to drink the water.

Sanskit Text: एतत तयन न योजनमचेति सस्वर्ह यन मरुतो गोतमो वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etat tyan na yojanamaceti sasvarha yan maruto ghotamo vaḥ |
Translation: 5 No hymn way ever known like this aforetime which Gotama sang forth for you, O Maruts,

Sanskit Text: पश्यन हिरण्यचक्रानयोदंष्ट्रान विधावतो वराहून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: paśyan hiraṇyacakrānayodaṃṣṭrān vidhāvato varāhūn ||
Translation: What time upon your golden wheels he saw you, wild boars rushing about with tusks of iron.

Sanskit Text: एषा सया वो मरुतो.अनुभर्त्री परति षटोभति वाघतो न वाणी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣā syā vo maruto.anubhartrī prati ṣṭobhati vāghato na vāṇī |
Translation: 6 To you this freshening draught of Soma rusheth, O Maruts, like the voice of one who prayeth.

Sanskit Text: अस्तोभयद वर्थासामनु सवधां गभस्त्योः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: astobhayad vṛthāsāmanu svadhāṃ ghabhastyoḥ ||
Translation: It rusheth freely from our hands as these libations wont to flow.

Sanskit Text: आ नो भद्राः करतवो कष्यन्तु विश्वतो.अदब्धासो अपरीतास उद्भिदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no bhadrāḥ kratavo kṣyantu viśvato.adabdhāso aparītāsa udbhidaḥ |
Translation: 1. MAY powers auspicious come to us from every side, never deceived, unhindered, and victorious,

Sanskit Text: देवा नो यथा सदमिद वर्धे असन्नप्रायुवो रक्षितारो दिवे-दिवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devā no yathā sadamid vṛdhe asannaprāyuvo rakṣitāro dive-dive ||
Translation: That the Gods ever may be with us for our gain, our guardians day by day unceasing in their care.

Sanskit Text: देवानां भद्रा सुमतिर्र्जूयतां देवानां रातिरभि नोनि वर्तताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānāṃ bhadrā sumatirṛjūyatāṃ devānāṃ rātirabhi noni vartatām |
Translation: 2 May the auspicious favour of the Gods be ours, on us descend the bounty of the righteous Gods.

Sanskit Text: देवानां सख्यमुप सेदिमा वयं देवा न आयुः पर तिरन्तु जीवसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānāṃ sakhyamupa sedimā vayaṃ devā na āyuḥ pra tirantu jīvase ||
Translation: The friendship of the Gods have we devoutly sought: so may the Gods extend our life that we may live.

Sanskit Text: तान पूर्वया निविदा हूमहे वयं भगं मित्रमदितिं दक्षमस्रिधम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tān pūrvayā nividā hūmahe vayaṃ bhaghaṃ mitramaditiṃ dakṣamasridham |
Translation: 3 We call them hither with a hymn of olden time, Bhaga, the friendly Dakṣa, Mitra, Aditi,

Sanskit Text: अर्यमणं वरुणं सोममश्विना सरस्वतीनः सुभगा मयस करत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aryamaṇaṃ varuṇaṃ somamaśvinā sarasvatīnaḥ subhaghā mayas karat ||
Translation: Aryaman, Varuṇa, Soma, the Aśvins. May Sarasvatī, auspicious, grant felicity.

Sanskit Text: तन नो वातो मयोभु वातु भेषजं तन माता पर्थिवी तत्पिता दयौः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no vāto mayobhu vātu bheṣajaṃ tan mātā pṛthivī tatpitā dyauḥ |
Translation: 4 May the Wind waft to us that pleasant medicine, may Earth our Mother give it, and our Father Heaven,

Sanskit Text: तद गरावाणः सोमसुतो मयोभुवस्तदश्विना शर्णुतं धिष्ण्या युवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad ghrāvāṇaḥ somasuto mayobhuvastadaśvinā śṛṇutaṃ dhiṣṇyā yuvam ||
Translation: And the joy-giving stones that press the Soma's juice. Aśvins, may ye, for whom our spirits long, hear this.

Sanskit Text: तमीशानं जगतस्तस्थुषस पतिं धियंजिन्वमवसे हूमहे वयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamīśānaṃ jaghatastasthuṣas patiṃ dhiyaṃjinvamavase hūmahe vayam |
Translation: 5 Him we invoke for aid who reigns supreme, the Lord of all that stands or moves, inspirer of the soul,

Sanskit Text: पूषा नो यथा वेदसामसद वर्धे रक्षिता पायुरदब्धः सवस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūṣā no yathā vedasāmasad vṛdhe rakṣitā pāyuradabdhaḥ svastaye ||
Translation: That Pūṣan may promote the increase of our wealth, our keeper and our guard infallible for our good.

Sanskit Text: सवस्ति न इन्द्रो वर्द्धश्रवाः सवस्ति नः पुषा विश्ववेदाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svasti na indro vṛddhaśravāḥ svasti naḥ puṣā viśvavedāḥ |
Translation: 6 Illustrious far and wide, may Indra prosper us: may Pūṣan prosper us, the Master of all wealth.

Sanskit Text: सवस्ति नस्तार्क्ष्यो अरिष्टनेमिः सवस्ति नो बर्हस्पतिर्दधातु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svasti nastārkṣyo ariṣṭanemiḥ svasti no bṛhaspatirdadhātu ||
Translation: May Tārkṣya with uninjured fellies prosper us: Bṛhaspati vouchsafe to us prosperity.

Sanskit Text: पर्षदश्वा मरुतः पर्श्निमातरः शुभंयावानो विदथेषुजग्मयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛṣadaśvā marutaḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ śubhaṃyāvāno vidatheṣujaghmayaḥ |
Translation: 7 The Maruts, Sons of Pṛśni, borne by spotted steeds, moving in glory, oft visiting holy rites,

Sanskit Text: अग्निजिह्वा मनवः सूरचक्षसो विश्वे नो देवा अवसा गमन्निह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnijihvā manavaḥ sūracakṣaso viśve no devā avasā ghamanniha ||
Translation: Sages whose tongue is Agni, brilliant as the Sun,—hither let all the Gods for our protection come.

Sanskit Text: भद्रं कर्णेभिः शर्णुयाम देवा भद्रं पश्येमाक्षभिर्यजत्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadraṃ karṇebhiḥ śṛṇuyāma devā bhadraṃ paśyemākṣabhiryajatrāḥ |
Translation: 8 Gods, may we with our ears listen to what is good, and with our eyes see what is good, ye Holy Ones.

Sanskit Text: सथिरैरङगैस्तुष्टुवांसस्तनूभिर्व्यशेमदेवहितं यदायुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sthirairaṅghaistuṣṭuvāṃsastanūbhirvyaśemadevahitaṃ yadāyuḥ ||
Translation: With limbs and bodies firm may we extolling you attain the term of life appointed by the Gods.

Sanskit Text: शतमिन नु शरदो अन्ति देवा यत्रा नश्चक्रा जरसं तनूनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śatamin nu śarado anti devā yatrā naścakrā jarasaṃ tanūnām |
Translation: 9 A hundred autumns stand before us, O ye Gods, within whose space ye bring our bodies to decay;

Sanskit Text: पुत्रासो यत्र पितरो भवन्ति मा नो मध्या रीरिषतायुर्गन्तोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: putrāso yatra pitaro bhavanti mā no madhyā rīriṣatāyurghantoḥ ||
Translation: Within whose space our sons become fathers in turn. Break ye not in the midst our course of fleeting life.

Sanskit Text: अदितिर्द्यौरदितिरन्तरिक्षमदितिर्माता स पिता स पुत्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aditirdyauraditirantarikṣamaditirmātā sa pitā sa putraḥ |
Translation: 10 Aditi is the heaven, Aditi is mid-air, Aditi is the Mother and the Sire and Son.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवा अदितिः पञ्च जना अदितिर्जातमदितिर्जनित्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devā aditiḥ pañca janā aditirjātamaditirjanitvam ||
Translation: Aditi is all Gods, Aditi five-classed men, Aditi all that hath been born and shall be born.

Sanskit Text: रजुनीती नो वरुणो मित्रो नयतु विद्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛjunītī no varuṇo mitro nayatu vidvān |
Translation: 1. MAY Varuṇa with guidance straight, and Mitra lead us, he who knows,

Sanskit Text: अर्यमा देवैः सजोषाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aryamā devaiḥ sajoṣāḥ ||
Translation: And Aryaman in accord with Gods.

Sanskit Text: ते हि वस्वो वसवानास्ते अप्रमूरा महोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te hi vasvo vasavānāste apramūrā mahobhiḥ |
Translation: 2 For they are dealers forth of wealth, and, not deluded, with their might

Sanskit Text: वरता रक्षन्ते विश्वाहा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vratā rakṣante viśvāhā ||
Translation: Guard evermore the holy laws.

Sanskit Text: ते अस्मभ्यं शर्म यंसन्नम्र्ता मर्त्येभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te asmabhyaṃ śarma yaṃsannamṛtā martyebhyaḥ |
Translation: 3 Shelter may they vouchsafe to us, Immortal Gods to mortal men,

Sanskit Text: बाधमानाप दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bādhamānāapa dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: Chasing our enemies away.

Sanskit Text: वि नः पथः सुविताय चियन्त्विन्द्रो मरुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi naḥ pathaḥ suvitāya ciyantvindro marutaḥ |
Translation: 4 May they mark out our paths to bliss, Indra, the Maruts, Pūṣan,

Sanskit Text: पूषा भगो वन्द्यासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūṣā bhagho vandyāsaḥ ||
Translation: and Bhaga, the Gods to be adored.

Sanskit Text: उत नो धियो गोग्राः पूषन विष्णवेवयावः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta no dhiyo ghoaghrāḥ pūṣan viṣṇavevayāvaḥ |
Translation: 5 Yea, Pūṣan, Viṣṇu, ye who run your course, enrich our hymns with kine;

Sanskit Text: कर्ता नः सवस्तिमतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kartā naḥ svastimataḥ ||
Translation: Bless us with all prosperity.

Sanskit Text: मधु वाता रतायते मधु कषरन्ति सिन्धवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhu vātā ṛtāyate madhu kṣaranti sindhavaḥ |
Translation: 6 The winds waft sweets, the rivers pour sweets for the man who keeps the Law

Sanskit Text: माध्वीर्नः सन्त्वोषधीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mādhvīrnaḥ santvoṣadhīḥ ||
Translation: So may the plants be sweet for us.

Sanskit Text: मधु नक्तमुतोषसो मधुमत पार्थिवं रजः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhu naktamutoṣaso madhumat pārthivaṃ rajaḥ |
Translation: 7 Sweet be the night and sweet the dawns, sweet the terrestrial atmosphere;

Sanskit Text: मधु दयौरस्तु नः पिता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhu dyaurastu naḥ pitā ||
Translation: Sweet be our Father Heaven to us.

Sanskit Text: मधुमान नो वनस्पतिर्मधुमानस्तु सूर्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhumān no vanaspatirmadhumānastu sūryaḥ |
Translation: 8 May the tall tree be full of sweets for us, and full of sweets the Sun:

Sanskit Text: माध्वीर्गावो भवन्तु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mādhvīrghāvo bhavantu naḥ ||
Translation: May our milch-kine be sweet for us.

Sanskit Text: शं नो मित्रः शं वरुणः शं नो भवत्वर्यमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no mitraḥ śaṃ varuṇaḥ śaṃ no bhavatvaryamā |
Translation: 9 Be Mitra gracious unto us, and Varuṇa and Aryaman:

Sanskit Text: शं न इन्द्रो बर्हस्पतिः शं नो विष्णुरुरुक्रमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ na indro bṛhaspatiḥ śaṃ no viṣṇururukramaḥ ||
Translation: Indra, Bṛhaspati be kind, and Viṣṇu of the mighty stride.

Sanskit Text: तवं सोम पर चिकितो मनीषा तवं रजिष्ठमनु नेषि पन्थाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ soma pra cikito manīṣā tvaṃ rajiṣṭhamanu neṣi panthām |
Translation: 1. Thou, Soma, art preeminent for wisdom; along the straightest path thou art our leader.

Sanskit Text: तव परणीती पितरो न इन्दो देवेषु रत्नमभजन्त धीराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava praṇītī pitaro na indo deveṣu ratnamabhajanta dhīrāḥ ||
Translation: Our wise forefathers by thy guidance, Indu, dealt out among the Gods their share of treasure.

Sanskit Text: तवं सोम करतुभिः सुभूस्त्वं दक्षैः सुदक्षो विश्ववेदाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ soma kratubhiḥ subhūstvaṃ dakṣaiḥ sudakṣo viśvavedāḥ |
Translation: 2 Thou by thine insight art most wise, O Soma, strong by thine energies and all possessing,

Sanskit Text: तवं वर्षा वर्षत्वेभिर्महित्वा दयुम्नेभिर्द्युम्न्यभवो नर्चक्षाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ vṛṣā vṛṣatvebhirmahitvā dyumnebhirdyumnyabhavo nṛcakṣāḥ ||
Translation: Mighty art thou by all thy powers and greatness, by glories art thou glorious, guide of mortals.

Sanskit Text: राज्ञो नु ते वरुणस्य वरतानि बर्हद गभीरं तव सोम धाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājño nu te varuṇasya vratāni bṛhad ghabhīraṃ tava soma dhāma |
Translation: 3 Thine are King Varuṇa's eternal statutes, lofty and deep, O Soma, is thy glory.

Sanskit Text: शुचिष टवमसि परियो न मित्रो दक्षाय्यो अर्यमेवासिसोम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuciṣ ṭvamasi priyo na mitro dakṣāyyo aryamevāsisoma ||
Translation: All-pure art thou like Mitra the beloved, adorable, like Aryaman, O Soma.

Sanskit Text: या ते धामानि दिवि या पर्थिव्यां या पर्वतेष्वोषधीष्वप्सु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā te dhāmāni divi yā pṛthivyāṃ yā parvateṣvoṣadhīṣvapsu |
Translation: 4 With all thy glories on the earth, in heaven, on mountains, in the plants, and in the waters,—

Sanskit Text: तेभिर्नो विश्वैः सुमना अहेळन राजन सोम परतिहव्या गर्भाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tebhirno viśvaiḥ sumanā aheḷan rājan soma pratihavyā ghṛbhāya ||
Translation: With all of these, well-pleased and not in anger, accept, O royal Soma, our oblations.

Sanskit Text: तवं सोमासि सत्पतिस्त्वं राजोत वर्त्रहा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ somāsi satpatistvaṃ rājota vṛtrahā |
Translation: 5 Thou, Soma, art the Lord of heroes, King, yea, Vṛtra-slayer thou:

Sanskit Text: तवं भद्रो असि करतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ bhadro asi kratuḥ ||
Translation: Thou art auspicious energy.

Sanskit Text: तवं च सोम नो वशो जीवातुं न मरामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ ca soma no vaśo jīvātuṃ na marāmahe |
Translation: 6 And, Soma, let it be thy wish that we may live and may not die:

Sanskit Text: परियस्तोत्रो वनस्पतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyastotro vanaspatiḥ ||
Translation: Praise-loving Lord of plants art thou.

Sanskit Text: तवं सोम महे भगं तवं यून रतायते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ soma mahe bhaghaṃ tvaṃ yūna ṛtāyate |
Translation: 7 To him who keeps the law, both old and young, thou givest happiness,

Sanskit Text: दक्षं दधासि जीवसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dakṣaṃ dadhāsi jīvase ||
Translation: And energy that he may live.

Sanskit Text: तवं नः सोम विश्वतो रक्षा राजन्नघायतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ soma viśvato rakṣā rājannaghāyataḥ |
Translation: 8 Guard us, King Soma, on all sides from him who threatens us: never let

Sanskit Text: न रिष्येत्त्वावतः सखा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na riṣyettvāvataḥ sakhā ||
Translation: The friend of one like thee be harmed.

Sanskit Text: सोम यास्ते मयोभुव ऊतयः सन्ति दाशुषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: soma yāste mayobhuva ūtayaḥ santi dāśuṣe |
Translation: 9 With those delightful aids which thou hast, Soma, for the worshipper,—

Sanskit Text: ताभिर्नो.अविता भव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tābhirno.avitā bhava ||
Translation: Even with those protect thou us.

Sanskit Text: इमं यज्ञमिदं वचो जुजुषाण उपागहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ yajñamidaṃ vaco jujuṣāṇa upāghahi |
Translation: 10 Accepting this our sacrifice and this our praise, O Soma, come,

Sanskit Text: सोम तवं नोव्र्धे भव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: soma tvaṃ novṛdhe bhava ||
Translation: And be thou nigh to prosper us.

Sanskit Text: सोम गीर्भिष टवा वयं वर्धयामो वचोविदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: soma ghīrbhiṣ ṭvā vayaṃ vardhayāmo vacovidaḥ |
Translation: 11 Well-skilled in speech we magnify thee, Soma, with our sacred songs:

Sanskit Text: सुम्र्ळीकोन आ विश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sumṛḷīkona ā viśa ||
Translation: Come thou to us, most gracious One.

Sanskit Text: गयस्फानो अमीवहा वसुवित पुष्टिवर्धनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghayasphāno amīvahā vasuvit puṣṭivardhanaḥ |
Translation: 12 Enricher, healer of disease, wealth-finder, prospering our store,

Sanskit Text: सुमित्रः सोमनो भव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sumitraḥ somano bhava ||
Translation: Be, Soma, a good Friend to us.

Sanskit Text: सोम रारन्धि नो हर्दि गावो न यवसेष्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: soma rārandhi no hṛdi ghāvo na yavaseṣvā |
Translation: 13 Soma, be happy in our heart, as milch-kine in the grassy meads,

Sanskit Text: मर्य इव सवोक्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: marya iva svaokye ||
Translation: As a young man in his own house.

Sanskit Text: यः सोम सख्ये तव रारणद देव मर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ soma sakhye tava rāraṇad deva martyaḥ |
Translation: 14 O Soma, God, the mortal man who in thy friendship hath delight,

Sanskit Text: तं दक्षः सचते कविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ dakṣaḥ sacate kaviḥ ||
Translation: Him doth the mighty Sage befriend.

Sanskit Text: उरुष्या णो अभिशस्तेः सोम नि पाह्यंहसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uruṣyā ṇo abhiśasteḥ soma ni pāhyaṃhasaḥ |
Translation: 15 Save us from slanderous reproach, keep us., O Soma, from distress:

Sanskit Text: सखा सुशेव एधि नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhā suśeva edhi naḥ ||
Translation: Be unto us a gracious Friend.

Sanskit Text: आ पयायस्व समेतु ते विश्वतः सोम वर्ष्ण्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā pyāyasva sametu te viśvataḥ soma vṛṣṇyam |
Translation: 16 Soma, wax great. From every side may vigorous powers unite in thee:

Sanskit Text: भवा वाजस्य संगथे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhavā vājasya saṃghathe ||
Translation: Be in the gathering-place of strength.

Sanskit Text: आ पयायस्व मदिन्तम सोम विश्वेभिरंशुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā pyāyasva madintama soma viśvebhiraṃśubhiḥ |
Translation: 17 Wax, O most gladdening Soma, great through all thy rays of light, and be

Sanskit Text: भवा नःसुश्रवस्तमः सखा वर्धे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhavā naḥsuśravastamaḥ sakhā vṛdhe ||
Translation: A Friend of most illustrious fame to prosper us.

Sanskit Text: सं ते पयांसि समु यन्तु वाजाः सं वर्ष्ण्यान्यभिमातिषाहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ te payāṃsi samu yantu vājāḥ saṃ vṛṣṇyānyabhimātiṣāhaḥ |
Translation: 16 In thee be juicy nutriments united, and powers and mighty foe-subduing vigour,

Sanskit Text: आप्यायमानो अम्र्ताय सोम दिवि शरवांस्युत्तमानि धिष्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpyāyamāno amṛtāya soma divi śravāṃsyuttamāni dhiṣva ||
Translation: Waxing to immortality, O Soma: win highest glories for thyself in heaven.

Sanskit Text: या ते धामानि हविषा यजन्ति ता ते विश्वा परिभूरस्तुयज्ञम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā te dhāmāni haviṣā yajanti tā te viśvā paribhūrastuyajñam |
Translation: 19 Such of thy glories as with poured oblations men honour, may they all invest our worship.

Sanskit Text: गयस्फानः परतरणः सुवीरो.अवीरहा पर चरा सोम दुर्यान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghayasphānaḥ prataraṇaḥ suvīro.avīrahā pra carā soma duryān ||
Translation: Wealth-giver, furtherer with troops of heroes, sparing the brave, come, Soma, to our houses.

Sanskit Text: सोमो धेनुं सोमो अर्वन्तमाशुं सोमो वीरं कर्मण्यं ददाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somo dhenuṃ somo arvantamāśuṃ somo vīraṃ karmaṇyaṃ dadāti |
Translation: 20 To him who worships Soma gives the milch-cow, a fleet steed and a man of active knowledge,

Sanskit Text: सादन्यं विदथ्यं सभेयं पित्र्श्रवणं यो ददाशदस्मै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sādanyaṃ vidathyaṃ sabheyaṃ pitṛśravaṇaṃ yo dadāśadasmai ||
Translation: Skilled in home duties, meet for holy synod, for council meet, a glory to his father.

Sanskit Text: अषाळ्हं युत्सु पर्तनासु पप्रिं सवर्षामप्सां वर्जनस्यगोपाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṣāḷhaṃ yutsu pṛtanāsu papriṃ svarṣāmapsāṃ vṛjanasyaghopām |
Translation: 21 Invincible in fight, saver in battles, guard of our camp, winner of light and water,

Sanskit Text: भरेषुजां सुक्षितिं सुश्रवसं जयन्तं तवामनु मदेम सोम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhareṣujāṃ sukṣitiṃ suśravasaṃ jayantaṃ tvāmanu madema soma ||
Translation: Born amid hymns, well-housed, exceeding famous, victor, in thee will we rejoice, O Soma.

Sanskit Text: तवमिमा ओषधीः सोम विश्वास्त्वमपो अजनयस्त्वं गाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamimā oṣadhīḥ soma viśvāstvamapo ajanayastvaṃ ghāḥ |
Translation: 22 These herbs, these milch-kine, and these running waters, all these, O Soma, thou hast generated.

Sanskit Text: तवमा ततन्थोर्वन्तरिक्षं तवं जयोतिषा वि तमो ववर्थ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamā tatanthorvantarikṣaṃ tvaṃ jyotiṣā vi tamo vavartha ||
Translation: The spacious firmament hast thou expanded, and with the light thou hast dispelled the darkness.

Sanskit Text: देवेन नो मनसा देव सोम रायो भागं सहसावन्नभि युध्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devena no manasā deva soma rāyo bhāghaṃ sahasāvannabhi yudhya |
Translation: 23 Do thou, God Soma, with thy Godlike spirit, victorious, win for us a share of riches.

Sanskit Text: मा तवा तनदीशिषे वीर्यस्योभयेभ्यः पर चिकित्सा गविष्टौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā tvā tanadīśiṣe vīryasyobhayebhyaḥ pra cikitsā ghaviṣṭau ||
Translation: Let none prevent thee: thou art Lord of valour. Provide for both sides in the fray for booty.

Sanskit Text: एता उ तया उषसः केतुमक्रत पूर्वे अर्धे रजसो भानुमञ्जते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etā u tyā uṣasaḥ ketumakrata pūrve ardhe rajaso bhānumañjate |
Translation: 1. THESE Dawns have raised their banner; in the eastern half of the mid-air they spread abroad their shining light.

Sanskit Text: निष्क्र्ण्वाना आयुधानीव धर्ष्णवः परति गावोऽरुषीर्यन्ति मातरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niṣkṛṇvānā āyudhānīva dhṛṣṇavaḥ prati ghāvo'ruṣīryanti mātaraḥ ||
Translation: Like heroes who prepare their weapons for the war, onward they come bright red in hue, the Mother Cows.

Sanskit Text: उदपप्तन्नरुणा भानवो वर्था सवायुजो अरुषीर्गा अयुक्सत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udapaptannaruṇā bhānavo vṛthā svāyujo aruṣīrghā ayuksata |
Translation: 2 Readily have the purple beams of light shot up; the Red Cows have they harnessed, easy to be yoked.

Sanskit Text: अक्रन्नुषासो वयुनानि पूर्वथा रुशन्तं भानुमरुषीरशिश्रयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: akrannuṣāso vayunāni pūrvathā ruśantaṃ bhānumaruṣīraśiśrayuḥ ||
Translation: The Dawns have brought distinct perception as before: red-hued, they have attained their fulgent brilliancy.

Sanskit Text: अर्चन्ति नारीरपसो न विष्टिभिः समानेन योजनेना परावतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arcanti nārīrapaso na viṣṭibhiḥ samānena yojanenā parāvataḥ |
Translation: 3 They sing their song like women active in their tasks, along their common path hither from far away,

Sanskit Text: इषं वहन्तीः सुक्र्ते सुदानवे विश्वेदह यजमानाय सुन्वते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣaṃ vahantīḥ sukṛte sudānave viśvedaha yajamānāya sunvate ||
Translation: Bringing refreshment to the liberal devotee, yea, all things to the worshipper who pours the juice.

Sanskit Text: अधि पेशांसि वपते नर्तूरिवापोर्णुते वक्ष उस्रेव बर्जहम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi peśāṃsi vapate nṛtūrivāporṇute vakṣa usreva barjaham |
Translation: 4 She, like a dancer, puts her broidered garments on: as a cow yields her udder so she bares her breast.

Sanskit Text: जयोतिर्विश्वस्मै भुवनाय कर्ण्वती गावो न वरजं वयुषा आवर्तमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyotirviśvasmai bhuvanāya kṛṇvatī ghāvo na vrajaṃ vyuṣā āvartamaḥ ||
Translation: Creating light for all the world of life, the Dawn hath laid the darkness open as the cows their stall.

Sanskit Text: परत्यर्ची रुशदस्या अदर्शि वि तिष्ठते बाधते कर्ष्णमभ्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratyarcī ruśadasyā adarśi vi tiṣṭhate bādhate kṛṣṇamabhvam |
Translation: 5 We have beheld the brightness of her shining; it spreads and drives away the darksome monster.

Sanskit Text: सवरुं न पेशो विदथेष्वञ्जञ्चित्रं दिवो दुहिता भानुमश्रेत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svaruṃ na peśo vidatheṣvañjañcitraṃ divo duhitā bhānumaśret ||
Translation: Like tints that deck the Post at sacrifices, Heaven's Daughter hath attained her wondrous splendour.

Sanskit Text: अतारिष्म तमसस पारमस्योषा उछन्ती वयुना कर्णोति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atāriṣma tamasas pāramasyoṣā uchantī vayunā kṛṇoti |
Translation: 6 We have o’erpast the limit of this darkness; Dawn breaking forth again brings clear perception.

Sanskit Text: शरिये छन्दो न समयते विभाती सुप्रतीका सौमनसायाजीगः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śriye chando na smayate vibhātī supratīkā saumanasāyājīghaḥ ||
Translation: She like a flatterer smiles in light for glory, and fair of face hath wakened to rejoice us.

Sanskit Text: भास्वती नेत्री सून्र्तानां दिव सतवे दुहिता गोतमेभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhāsvatī netrī sūnṛtānāṃ diva stave duhitā ghotamebhiḥ |
Translation: 7 The Gotamas have praised Heaven's radiant Daughter, the leader of the charm of pleasant voices.

Sanskit Text: परजावतो नर्वतो अश्वबुध्यानुषो गोग्रानुप मासि वाजान ||
