Sanskrit Transliteration: prajāvato nṛvato aśvabudhyānuṣo ghoaghrānupa māsi vājān ||
Translation: Dawn, thou conferrest on us strength with offspring and men, conspicuous with kine and horses.

Sanskit Text: उषस्तमश्यां यशसं सुवीरं दासप्रवर्गं रयिमश्वबुध्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣastamaśyāṃ yaśasaṃ suvīraṃ dāsapravarghaṃ rayimaśvabudhyam |
Translation: 8 O thou who shinest forth in wondrous glory, urged onward by thy strength, auspicious Lady,

Sanskit Text: सुदंससा शरवसा या विभासि वाजप्रसूता सुभगे बर्हन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sudaṃsasā śravasā yā vibhāsi vājaprasūtā subhaghe bṛhantam ||
Translation: Dawn, may I gain that wealth, renowned and ample, in brave sons, troops of slaves, far-famed for horses.

Sanskit Text: विश्वानि देवी भुवनाभिचक्ष्या परतीची चक्षुरुर्विया वि भाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāni devī bhuvanābhicakṣyā pratīcī cakṣururviyā vi bhāti |
Translation: 9 Bending her looks on all the world, the Goddess shines, widely spreading with her bright eye westward.

Sanskit Text: विश्वं जीवं चरसे बोधयन्ती विश्वस्य वाचमविदन मनायोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvaṃ jīvaṃ carase bodhayantī viśvasya vācamavidan manāyoḥ ||
Translation: Waking to motion every living creature, she understands the voice of each adorer.

Sanskit Text: पुनः-पुनर्जायमाना पुराणी समानं वर्णमभि शुम्भमाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: punaḥ-punarjāyamānā purāṇī samānaṃ varṇamabhi śumbhamānā |
Translation: 10 Ancient of days, again again born newly, decking her beauty with the self-same raiment.

Sanskit Text: शवघ्नीव कर्त्नुर्विज आमिनाना मर्तस्य देवी जरयन्त्यायुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śvaghnīva kṛtnurvija āminānā martasya devī jarayantyāyuḥ ||
Translation: The Goddess wastes away the life of mortals, like a skilled hunter cutting birds in pieces.

Sanskit Text: वयूर्ण्वती दिवो अन्तानबोध्यप सवसारं सनुतर्युयोति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyūrṇvatī divo antānabodhyapa svasāraṃ sanutaryuyoti |
Translation: 11 She hath appeared discovering heaven's borders: to the far distance she drives off her Sister.

Sanskit Text: परमिनती मनुष्या युगानि योषा जारस्य चक्षसा वि भाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: praminatī manuṣyā yughāni yoṣā jārasya cakṣasā vi bhāti ||
Translation: Diminishing the days of human creatures, the Lady shines with all her lover's splendour.

Sanskit Text: पशून न चित्रा सुभगा परथाना सिन्धुर्न कषोद उर्विया वयश्वैत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: paśūn na citrā subhaghā prathānā sindhurna kṣoda urviyā vyaśvait |
Translation: 12 The bright, the blessed One shines forth extending her rays like kine, as a flood rolls his waters.

Sanskit Text: अमिनती दैव्यानि वरतानि सूर्यस्य चेति रश्मिभिर्द्र्शाना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aminatī daivyāni vratāni sūryasya ceti raśmibhirdṛśānā ||
Translation: Never transgressing the divine commandments, she is beheld visible with the sunbeams.

Sanskit Text: उषस्तच्चित्रमा भरास्मभ्यं वाजिनीवति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣastaccitramā bharāsmabhyaṃ vājinīvati |
Translation: 13 O Dawn enriched with ample wealth, bestow on us the wondrous gift

Sanskit Text: येन तोकंच तनयं च धामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena tokaṃca tanayaṃ ca dhāmahe ||
Translation: Wherewith we may support children and children's sons.

Sanskit Text: उषो अद्येह गोमत्यश्वावति विभावरि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣo adyeha ghomatyaśvāvati vibhāvari |
Translation: 14 Thou radiant mover of sweet sounds, with wealth of horses and of kine

Sanskit Text: रेवदस्मे वयुछ सून्र्तावति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: revadasme vyucha sūnṛtāvati ||
Translation: Shine thou on us this day, O Dawn auspiciously.

Sanskit Text: युक्ष्वा हि वाजिनीवत्यश्वानद्यारुणानुषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yukṣvā hi vājinīvatyaśvānadyāruṇānuṣaḥ |
Translation: 15 O Dawn enriched with holy rites, yoke to thy car thy purple steeds,

Sanskit Text: अथा नोविश्वा सौभगान्या वह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā noviśvā saubhaghānyā vaha ||
Translation: And then bring thou unto us all felicities.

Sanskit Text: अश्विना वर्तिरस्मदा गोमद दस्रा हिरण्यवत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvinā vartirasmadā ghomad dasrā hiraṇyavat |
Translation: 16 O Aśvins wonderful in act, do ye unanimous direct

Sanskit Text: अर्वाग रथं समनसा नि यछतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāgh rathaṃ samanasā ni yachatam ||
Translation: Your chariot to our home wealthy in kine and gold.

Sanskit Text: यावित्था शलोकमा दिवो जयोतिर्जनाय चक्रथुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāvitthā ślokamā divo jyotirjanāya cakrathuḥ |
Translation: 17 Ye who brought down the hymn from heaven, a light that giveth light to man,

Sanskit Text: आ नूर्जं वहतमश्विना युवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā naūrjaṃ vahatamaśvinā yuvam ||
Translation: Do ye, O Aśvins, bring strength hither unto us.

Sanskit Text: एह देवा मयोभुवा दस्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eha devā mayobhuvā dasrā hiraṇyavartanī |
Translation: 18 Hither may they who wake at dawn bring, to drink Soma both the Gods

Sanskit Text: उषर्बुधो वहन्तु सोमपीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣarbudho vahantu somapītaye ||
Translation: Health-givers Wonder-Workers, borne on paths of gold.

Sanskit Text: अग्नीषोमाविमं सु मे शर्णुतं वर्षणा हवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnīṣomāvimaṃ su me śṛṇutaṃ vṛṣaṇā havam |
Translation: 1 AGNI and Soma, mighty Pair, graciously hearken to my call,

Sanskit Text: परति सूक्तानि हर्यतं भवतं दाशुषे मयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati sūktāni haryataṃ bhavataṃ dāśuṣe mayaḥ ||
Translation: Accept in friendly wise my hymn, and prosper him who offers gifts.

Sanskit Text: अग्नीषोमा यो अद्य वामिदं वचः सपर्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnīṣomā yo adya vāmidaṃ vacaḥ saparyati |
Translation: 2 The man who honours you to-day, Agni and Soma, with this hymn,

Sanskit Text: तस्मै धत्तं सुवीर्यं गवां पोषं सवश्व्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmai dhattaṃ suvīryaṃ ghavāṃ poṣaṃ svaśvyam ||
Translation: Bestow on him heroic strength, increase of kine, and noble steeds.

Sanskit Text: अग्नीषोमा य आहुतिं यो वां दाशाद धविष्क्र्तिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnīṣomā ya āhutiṃ yo vāṃ dāśād dhaviṣkṛtim |
Translation: 3 The man who offers holy oil and burnt oblations unto you,

Sanskit Text: स परजया सुवीर्यं विश्वमायुर्व्यश्नवत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa prajayā suvīryaṃ viśvamāyurvyaśnavat ||
Translation: Agni and Soma, shall enjoy great strength, with offspring, all his life.

Sanskit Text: अग्नीषोमा चेति तद वीर्यं वां यदमुष्णीतमवसं पणिं गाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnīṣomā ceti tad vīryaṃ vāṃ yadamuṣṇītamavasaṃ paṇiṃ ghāḥ |
Translation: 4 Agni and Soma, famed is that your. prowess wherewith ye stole the kine, his food, from Paṇi.

Sanskit Text: अवातिरतं बर्सयस्य शेषो.अविन्दतं जयोतिरेकं बहुभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avātirataṃ bṛsayasya śeṣo.avindataṃ jyotirekaṃ bahubhyaḥ ||
Translation: Ye caused the brood of Bṛsaya to perish; ye found the light, the single light for many.

Sanskit Text: युवमेतानि दिवि रोचनान्यग्निश्च सोम सक्रतू अधत्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvametāni divi rocanānyaghniśca soma sakratū adhattam |
Translation: 5 Agni and Soma, joined in operation ye have set up the shining lights in heaven.

Sanskit Text: युवं सिन्धून्रभिशस्तेरवद्यादग्नीषोमावमुञ्चतं गर्भीतान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ sindhūnrabhiśasteravadyādaghnīṣomāvamuñcataṃ ghṛbhītān ||
Translation: From curse and from reproach, Agni and Soma, ye freed the rivers that were bound in fetters.

Sanskit Text: आन्यं दिवो मातरिश्वा जभारामथ्नादन्यं परि शयेनोद्रेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ānyaṃ divo mātariśvā jabhārāmathnādanyaṃ pari śyenoadreḥ |
Translation: 6 One of you Mātariśvan brought from heaven, the Falcon rent the other from the mountain.

Sanskit Text: अग्नीषोमा बरह्मणा वाव्र्धानोरुं यज्ञाय चक्रथुरु लोकम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnīṣomā brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānoruṃ yajñāya cakrathuru lokam ||
Translation: Strengthened by holy prayer Agni and Soma have made us ample room for sacrificing.

Sanskit Text: अग्नीषोमा हविषः परस्थितस्य वीतं हर्यतं वर्षणा जुषेथाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnīṣomā haviṣaḥ prasthitasya vītaṃ haryataṃ vṛṣaṇā juṣethām |
Translation: 7 Taste, Agni, Soma, this prepared oblation; accept it, Mighty Ones, and let it please you.

Sanskit Text: सुशर्माणा सववसा हि भूतमथा धत्तं यजमानाय शं योः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suśarmāṇā svavasā hi bhūtamathā dhattaṃ yajamānāya śaṃ yoḥ ||
Translation: Vouchsafe us good protection and kind favour: grant to the sacrificer health and riches.

Sanskit Text: यो अग्नीषोमा हविषा सपर्याद देवद्रीचा मनसा यो घर्तेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo aghnīṣomā haviṣā saparyād devadrīcā manasā yo ghṛtena |
Translation: 8 Whoso with oil and poured oblation honours, with God-devoted heart, Agni and Soma,—

Sanskit Text: तस्य वरतं रक्षतं पातमंहसो विशे जनाय महिशर्म यछतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya vrataṃ rakṣataṃ pātamaṃhaso viśe janāya mahiśarma yachatam ||
Translation: Protect his sacrifice, preserve him from distress, grant to the sacrificer great felicity.

Sanskit Text: अग्नीषोमा सवेदसा सहूती वनतं गिरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnīṣomā savedasā sahūtī vanataṃ ghiraḥ |
Translation: 9 Invoked together, mates in wealth, Agni-Soma, accept our hymns:

Sanskit Text: सं देवत्रा बभूवथुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ devatrā babhūvathuḥ ||
Translation: Together be among the Gods.

Sanskit Text: अग्नीषोमावनेन वां यो वां घर्तेन दाशति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnīṣomāvanena vāṃ yo vāṃ ghṛtena dāśati |
Translation: 10 Agni and Soma, unto him who worships you with holy oil

Sanskit Text: तस्मै दीदयतं बर्हत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmai dīdayataṃ bṛhat ||
Translation: Shine forth an ample recompense.

Sanskit Text: अग्नीषोमाविमानि नो युवं हव्या जुजोषतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnīṣomāvimāni no yuvaṃ havyā jujoṣatam |
Translation: 11 Agni and Soma, be ye pleased with these oblations brought to you,

Sanskit Text: आ यातमुपनः सचा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yātamupanaḥ sacā ||
Translation: And come, together, nigh to us.

Sanskit Text: अग्नीषोमा पिप्र्तमर्वतो न आ पयायन्तामुस्रिया हव्यसूदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnīṣomā pipṛtamarvato na ā pyāyantāmusriyā havyasūdaḥ |
Translation: 12 Agni and Soma, cherish well our horses, and let our cows be fat who yield oblations.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे बलानि मघवत्सु धत्तं कर्णुतं नो अध्वरं शरुष्टिमन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme balāni maghavatsu dhattaṃ kṛṇutaṃ no adhvaraṃ śruṣṭimantam ||
Translation: Grant power to us and to our wealthy patrons, and cause our holy rites to be successful.

Sanskit Text: इमं सतोममर्हते जातवेदसे रथमिव सं महेमा मनीषया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ stomamarhate jātavedase rathamiva saṃ mahemā manīṣayā |
Translation: 1 FOR Jātavedas worthy of our praise will we frame with our mind this eulogy as ’twere a car.

Sanskit Text: भद्रा हि नः परमतिरस्य संसद्यग्ने सख्ये मा रिषामा वयं तव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadrā hi naḥ pramatirasya saṃsadyaghne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava ||
Translation: For good, in his assembly, is this care of ours. Let us not, in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

Sanskit Text: यस्मै तवमायजसे स साधत्यनर्वा कषेति दधते सुवीर्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasmai tvamāyajase sa sādhatyanarvā kṣeti dadhate suvīryam |
Translation: 2 The man for whom thou sacrificest prospereth, dwelleth without a foe, gaineth heroic might.

Sanskit Text: स तूताव नैनमश्नोत्यंहतिरग्ने ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tūtāva nainamaśnotyaṃhatiraghne ... ||
Translation: He waxeth strong, distress never approacheth him. Let us not, in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

Sanskit Text: शकेम तवा समिधं साधया धियस्त्वे देवा हविरदन्त्याहुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śakema tvā samidhaṃ sādhayā dhiyastve devā haviradantyāhutam |
Translation: 3 May we have power to kindle thee. Fulfil our thoughts. In thee the Gods eat the presented offering,

Sanskit Text: तवमादित्याना वह तान हयुश्मस्यग्ने ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamādityānā vaha tān hyuśmasyaghne ... ||
Translation: Bring hither the Ādityas, for we long for them. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

Sanskit Text: भरामेध्मं कर्णवामा हवींषि ते चितयन्तः पर्वणा-पर्वणा वयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharāmedhmaṃ kṛṇavāmā havīṃṣi te citayantaḥ parvaṇā-parvaṇā vayam |
Translation: 4 We will bring fuel and prepare burnt offerings, reminding thee at each successive festival.

Sanskit Text: जीवातवे परतरं साधया धियो.अग्ने ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jīvātave prataraṃ sādhayā dhiyo.aghne ... ||
Translation: Fulfil our thought that so we may prolong our lives. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

Sanskit Text: विशां गोपा अस्य चरन्ति जन्तवो दविपच्च यदुत चतुष्पदक्तुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśāṃ ghopā asya caranti jantavo dvipacca yaduta catuṣpadaktubhiḥ |
Translation: 5 His ministers move forth, the guardians of the folk, protecting quadruped and biped with their rays.

Sanskit Text: चित्रः परकेत उषसो महानस्य अग्ने ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: citraḥ praketa uṣaso mahānasya aghne ... ||
Translation: Mighty art thou, the wondrous herald of the Dawn. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

Sanskit Text: तवमध्वर्युरुत होतासि पूर्व्यः परशास्ता पोता जनुषा पुरोहितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamadhvaryuruta hotāsi pūrvyaḥ praśāstā potā januṣā purohitaḥ |
Translation: 6 Thou art Presenter and the chief Invoker, thou Director, Purifier, great High Priest by birth.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा विद्वानार्त्विज्या धीर पुष्यस्यग्ने .. . ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā vidvānārtvijyā dhīra puṣyasyaghne .. . ||
Translation: Knowing all priestly work thou perfectest it, Sage. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

Sanskit Text: यो विश्वतः सुप्रतीकः सद्रंं असि दूरे चित सन तळिदिवाति रोचसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo viśvataḥ supratīkaḥ sadṛṃṃ asi dūre cit san taḷidivāti rocase |
Translation: 7 Lovely of form art thou, alike on every side; though far, thou shinest brightly as if close at hand.

Sanskit Text: रात्र्याश्चिदन्धो अति देव पश्यस्यग्ने ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rātryāścidandho ati deva paśyasyaghne ... ||
Translation: O God, thou seest through even the dark of night. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

Sanskit Text: पूर्वो देवा भवतु सुन्वतो रथो.अस्माकं शंसो अभ्यस्तु दूढ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvo devā bhavatu sunvato ratho.asmākaṃ śaṃso abhyastu dūḍhyaḥ |
Translation: 8 Gods, foremost be his car who pours libations out, and let our hymn prevail o’er evil-hearted men.

Sanskit Text: तदा जानीतोत पुष्यता वचो.अग्ने ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadā jānītota puṣyatā vaco.aghne ... ||
Translation: Attend to this our speech and make it prosper well. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

Sanskit Text: वधैर्दुःशंसानप दूढ्यो जहि दूरे वा ये अन्ति वा के चिदत्रिणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vadhairduḥśaṃsānapa dūḍhyo jahi dūre vā ye anti vā ke cidatriṇaḥ |
Translation: 9 Smite with thy weapons those of evil speech and thought, devouring demons, whether near or tar away.

Sanskit Text: अथा यज्ञाय गर्णते सुगं कर्ध्यग्ने ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā yajñāya ghṛṇate sughaṃ kṛdhyaghne ... ||
Translation: Then to the singer give free way for sacrifice. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

Sanskit Text: यदयुक्था अरुषा रोहिता रथे वातजूता वर्षभस्येव तेरवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadayukthā aruṣā rohitā rathe vātajūtā vṛṣabhasyeva teravaḥ |
Translation: 10 When to thy chariot thou hadst yoked two red steeds and two ruddy steeds, wind-sped, thy roar was like a bull's.

Sanskit Text: आदिन्वसि वनिनो धूमकेतुनाग्ने ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādinvasi vanino dhūmaketunāghne ... ||
Translation: Thou with smoke-bannered flame attackest forest trees. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

Sanskit Text: अध सवनादुत बिभ्युः पतत्रिणो दरप्सा यत ते यवसादो वयस्थिरन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha svanāduta bibhyuḥ patatriṇo drapsā yat te yavasādo vyasthiran |
Translation: 11 Then at thy roar the very birds are terrified, when, eating-up the grass, thy sparks fly forth abroad.

Sanskit Text: सुगं तत ते तावकेभ्यो रथेभ्यो.अग्ने ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sughaṃ tat te tāvakebhyo rathebhyo.aghne ... ||
Translation: Then is it easy for thee and thy car to pass. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

Sanskit Text: अयं मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धायसे.अवयातां मरुतां हेळो अद्भुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ mitrasya varuṇasya dhāyase.avayātāṃ marutāṃ heḷo adbhutaḥ |
Translation: 12 He hath the Power to soothe Mitra and Varuṇa: wonderful is the Maruts’ wrath when they descend.

Sanskit Text: मर्ळा सु नो भूत्वेषां मनः पुनरग्ने ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mṛḷā su no bhūtveṣāṃ manaḥ punaraghne ... ||
Translation: Be gracious; let their hearts he turned to us again. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

Sanskit Text: देवो देवानामसि मित्रो अद्भुतो वसुर्वसूनामसि चारुरध्वरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devo devānāmasi mitro adbhuto vasurvasūnāmasi cāruradhvare |
Translation: 13 Thou art a God, thou art the wondrous Friend of Gods, the Vasu of the Vasus, fair in sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: शर्मन सयाम तव सप्रथस्तमे.अग्ने ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śarman syāma tava saprathastame.aghne ... ||
Translation: Under, thine own most wide protection may we dwell. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

Sanskit Text: तत ते भद्रं यत समिद्धः सवे दमे सोमाहुतो जरसे मर्ळयत्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat te bhadraṃ yat samiddhaḥ sve dame somāhuto jarase mṛḷayattamaḥ |
Translation: 14 This is thy grace that, kindled in thine own abode, invoked with Soma thou soundest forth most benign,

Sanskit Text: दधासि रत्नं दरविणं च दाशुषे.अग्ने ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhāsi ratnaṃ draviṇaṃ ca dāśuṣe.aghne ... ||
Translation: Thou givest wealth and treasure to the worshipper. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

Sanskit Text: यस्मै तवं सुद्रविणो ददाशो.अनागास्त्वमदिते सर्वताता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasmai tvaṃ sudraviṇo dadāśo.anāghāstvamadite sarvatātā |
Translation: 15 To whom thou, Lord of goodly riches, grantest freedom from every sin with perfect wholeness,

Sanskit Text: यं भद्रेण शवसा चोदयासि परजावता राधसा ते सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ bhadreṇa śavasā codayāsi prajāvatā rādhasā te syāma ||
Translation: Whom with good strength thou

Sanskit Text: <a href="errata.htm#2">
quickenest
, with children and wealth—may we be they, Eternal Being.
स तवमग्ने सौभगत्वस्य विद्वानस्माकमायुः पर तिरेहदेव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvamaghne saubhaghatvasya vidvānasmākamāyuḥ pra tirehadeva |
Translation: 16 Such, Agni, thou who knowest all good fortune, God, lengthen here the days of our existence.

Sanskit Text: तन नो मित्रो वरुणो मामहन्तामदितिः सिन्धुः पर्थिवी उत दयौः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantāmaditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ ||
Translation: This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: दवे वीरूपे चरतः सवर्थे अन्यान्या वत्समुप धापयेते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dve vīrūpe carataḥ svarthe anyānyā vatsamupa dhāpayete |
Translation: 1. To fair goals travel Two unlike in semblance: each in succession nourishes an infant.

Sanskit Text: हरिरन्यस्यां भवति सवधावाञ्छुक्रो अन्यस्यां दद्र्शे सुवर्चाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hariranyasyāṃ bhavati svadhāvāñchukro anyasyāṃ dadṛśe suvarcāḥ ||
Translation: One bears a Godlike Babe of golden colour; bright and fair-shining, is he with the other.

Sanskit Text: दशेमं तवष्टुर्जनयन्त गर्भमतन्द्रासो युवतयो विभ्र्त्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśemaṃ tvaṣṭurjanayanta gharbhamatandrāso yuvatayo vibhṛtram |
Translation: 2 Tvaṣṭar's ten daughters, vigilant and youthful, produced this Infant borne to sundry quarters.

Sanskit Text: तिग्मानीकं सवयशसं जनेषु विरोचमानं परि षीं नयन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tighmānīkaṃ svayaśasaṃ janeṣu virocamānaṃ pari ṣīṃ nayanti ||
Translation: They bear around him whose long flames are pointed, fulgent among mankind with native splendour.

Sanskit Text: तरीणि जाना परि भूषन्त्यस्य समुद्र एकं दिव्येकमप्सु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trīṇi jānā pari bhūṣantyasya samudra ekaṃ divyekamapsu |
Translation: 3. Three several places of his birth they honour, in mid-air, in the heaven, and in the waters.

Sanskit Text: पूर्वामनु पर दिशं पार्थिवानां रतून परशासद विदधावनुष्ठु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvāmanu pra diśaṃ pārthivānāṃ ṛtūn praśāsad vidadhāvanuṣṭhu ||
Translation: Governing in the east of earthly regions, the seasons hath he stablished in their order.

Sanskit Text: क इमं वो निण्यमा चिकेत वत्सो मातॄर्जनयत सवधाभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ka imaṃ vo niṇyamā ciketa vatso mātṝrjanayata svadhābhiḥ |
Translation: 4 Who of you knows this secret One? The Infant by his own nature hath brought forth his Mothers.

Sanskit Text: बह्वीनां गर्भो अपसामुपस्थान महान कविर्निश्चरति सवधावान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bahvīnāṃ gharbho apasāmupasthān mahān kavirniścarati svadhāvān ||
Translation: The germ of many, from the waters' bosom he goes forth, wise and great, of Godlike nature.

Sanskit Text: आविष्ट्यो वर्धते चारुरासु जिह्मानामूर्ध्वः सवयशा उपस्थे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āviṣṭyo vardhate cārurāsu jihmānāmūrdhvaḥ svayaśā upasthe |
Translation: 5 Visible, fair, he grows in native brightness uplifted in the lap of waving waters.

Sanskit Text: उभे तवष्टुर्बिभ्यतुर्जायमानात परतीची सिंहम्प्रति जोषयेते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhe tvaṣṭurbibhyaturjāyamānāt pratīcī siṃhamprati joṣayete ||
Translation: When he was born both Tvaṣṭar's worlds were frightened: they turn to him and reverence the Lion.

Sanskit Text: उभे भद्रे जोषयेते न मेने गावो न वाश्रा उप तस्थुरेवैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhe bhadre joṣayete na mene ghāvo na vāśrā upa tasthurevaiḥ |
Translation: 6 The Two auspicious Ones, like women, tend him: like lowing cows they seek him in their manner.

Sanskit Text: स दक्षाणां दक्षपतिर्बभूवाञ्जन्ति यं दक्षिणतो हविर्भिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa dakṣāṇāṃ dakṣapatirbabhūvāñjanti yaṃ dakṣiṇato havirbhiḥ ||
Translation: He is the Lord of Might among the mighty; him, on the right, they balm with their oblations.

Sanskit Text: उद यंयमीति सवितेव बाहू उभे सिचौ यतते भीम रञ्जन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud yaṃyamīti saviteva bāhū ubhe sicau yatate bhīma ṛñjan |
Translation: 7 Like Savitar his arms with might he stretches; awful, he strives grasping the world's two borders.

Sanskit Text: उच्छुक्रमत्कमजते सिमस्मान नवा मात्र्भ्यो वसना जहाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ucchukramatkamajate simasmān navā mātṛbhyo vasanā jahāti ||
Translation: He forces out from all a brilliant vesture, yea, from his Mothers draws he forth new raiment.

Sanskit Text: तवेषं रूपं कर्णुत उत्तरं यत सम्प्र्ञ्चानः सदने गोभिरद्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tveṣaṃ rūpaṃ kṛṇuta uttaraṃ yat sampṛñcānaḥ sadane ghobhiradbhiḥ |
Translation: 8 He makes him a most noble form of splendour, decking him in his home with milk and waters.

Sanskit Text: कविर्बुध्नं परि मर्म्र्ज्यते धीः सा देवताता समितिर्बभूव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kavirbudhnaṃ pari marmṛjyate dhīḥ sā devatātā samitirbabhūva ||
Translation: The Sage adorns the depths of air with wisdom: this is the meeting where the Gods are worshipped.

Sanskit Text: उरु ते जरयः पर्येति बुध्नं विरोचमानं महिषस्य धाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uru te jrayaḥ paryeti budhnaṃ virocamānaṃ mahiṣasya dhāma |
Translation: 9 Wide through the firmament spreads forth triumphant the far-resplendent strength of thee the Mighty.

Sanskit Text: विश्वेभिरग्ने सवयशोभिरिद्धो.अदब्धेभिः पायुभिः पाह्यस्मान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvebhiraghne svayaśobhiriddho.adabdhebhiḥ pāyubhiḥ pāhyasmān ||
Translation: Kindled by us do thou preserve us, Agni, with all thy self-bright undiminished succours.

Sanskit Text: धन्वन सरोतः कर्णुते गातुमूर्मिं शुक्रैरूर्मिभिरभिनक्षति कषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhanvan srotaḥ kṛṇute ghātumūrmiṃ śukrairūrmibhirabhinakṣati kṣām |
Translation: 10 In dry spots he makes stream, and course, and torrent, and inundates the earth with floods that glisten.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा सनानि जठरेषु धत्ते.अन्तर्नवासु चरति परसूषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā sanāni jaṭhareṣu dhatte.antarnavāsu carati prasūṣu ||
Translation: All ancient things within his maw he gathers, and moves among the new fresh-sprouting grasses.

Sanskit Text: एवा नो अग्ने समिधा वर्धानो रेवत पावक शरवसे वि भाहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā no aghne samidhā vṛdhāno revat pāvaka śravase vi bhāhi |
Translation: 11 Fed with our fuel, purifying Agni, so blaze to us auspiciously for glory.

Sanskit Text: तन नो मित्रो वरुणो मामहन्ताम अदितिः सिन्धुः पर्थ्विवी उतो दयौः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthvivī uto dyauḥ ||
Translation: This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: स परत्नथा सहसा जायमानः सद्यः काव्यानि बळ अधत्त विश्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pratnathā sahasā jāyamānaḥ sadyaḥ kāvyāni baḷ adhatta viśvā |
Translation: 1. HE in the ancient way by strength engendered, lo! straight hath taken to himself all wisdom.

Sanskit Text: अपश्च मित्रं धिषणा च साधन देवा अग्निन्धारयन दरविणोदाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apaśca mitraṃ dhiṣaṇā ca sādhan devā aghnindhārayan draviṇodām ||
Translation: The waters and the bowl have made him friendly. The Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

Sanskit Text: स पूर्वया निविदा कव्यतायोरिमाः परजा अजनयन मनूनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pūrvayā nividā kavyatāyorimāḥ prajā ajanayan manūnām |
Translation: 2 At Āyu's ancient call he by his wisdom gave all this progeny of men their being,

Sanskit Text: विवस्वता चक्षसा दयामपश्च देवा अ. ध. द. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vivasvatā cakṣasā dyāmapaśca devā a. dh. d. ||
Translation: And, by refulgent light, heaven and the waters. The Gods possessed the wealth. bestowing Agni.

Sanskit Text: तमीळत परथमं यज्ञसाधं विश आरीराहुतं रञ्जसानम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamīḷata prathamaṃ yajñasādhaṃ viśa ārīrāhutaṃ ṛñjasānam |
Translation: 3 Praise him, ye Āryan folk, as chief performer of sacrifice adored and ever toiling,

Sanskit Text: ऊर्जः पुत्रं भरतं सर्प्रदानुं देवा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrjaḥ putraṃ bharataṃ sṛpradānuṃ devā ... ||
Translation: Well-tended, Son of Strength, the Constant Giver. The Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

Sanskit Text: स मातरिश्वा पुरुवारपुष्टिर्विदद गातुं तनयाय सवर्वित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa mātariśvā puruvārapuṣṭirvidad ghātuṃ tanayāya svarvit |
Translation: 4 That Mātariśvan rich in wealth and treasure, light-winner, finds a pathway for his offspring.

Sanskit Text: विशां गोपा जनिता रोदस्योर्देवा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśāṃ ghopā janitā rodasyordevā ... ||
Translation: Guard of our folk, Father of earth and heaven. The Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

Sanskit Text: नक्तोषासा वर्णमामेम्याने धापयेते शिशुमेकं समीची |
Sanskrit Transliteration: naktoṣāsā varṇamāmemyāne dhāpayete śiśumekaṃ samīcī |
Translation: 5 Night and Dawn, changing each the other's colour, meeting together suckle one same Infant:

Sanskit Text: दयावाक्षामा रुक्मो अन्तर्वि भाति देवा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyāvākṣāmā rukmo antarvi bhāti devā ... ||
Translation: Golden between the heaven and earth he shineth. The Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

Sanskit Text: रायो बुध्नः संगमनो वसूनां यज्ञस्य केतुर्मन्मसाधनो वेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyo budhnaḥ saṃghamano vasūnāṃ yajñasya keturmanmasādhano veḥ |
Translation: 6 Root of wealth, gathering-place of treasures, banner of sacrifice, who grants the suppliant's wishes:

Sanskit Text: अम्र्तत्वं रक्षमाणास एनं देवा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: amṛtatvaṃ rakṣamāṇāsa enaṃ devā ... ||
Translation: Preserving him as their own life immortal, the Gods possessed the wealth-bestowing Agni.

Sanskit Text: नू च पुरा च सदनं रयीणां जातस्य च जायमानस्य च कषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū ca purā ca sadanaṃ rayīṇāṃ jātasya ca jāyamānasya ca kṣām |
Translation: 7 Now and of old the home of wealth, the mansion of what is born and what was born aforetime,

Sanskit Text: सतश्च गोपां भवतश्च भूरेर्देवा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sataśca ghopāṃ bhavataśca bhūrerdevā ... ||
Translation: Guard of what is and what will be hereafter,—the Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

Sanskit Text: दरविणोदा दरविणसस्तुरस्य दरविणोदाः सनरस्य पर यंसत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: draviṇodā draviṇasasturasya draviṇodāḥ sanarasya pra yaṃsat |
Translation: 8 May the Wealth-Giver grant us conquering riches; may the Wealth-Giver grant us wealth with heroes.

Sanskit Text: दरविणोदा वीरवतीमिषं नो दरविणोदा रसते दीर्घमायुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: draviṇodā vīravatīmiṣaṃ no draviṇodā rasate dīrghamāyuḥ ||
Translation: May the Wealth-Giver grant us food with offspring, and length of days may the Wealth-Giver send us.

Sanskit Text: एवा नो अग्ने समिधा वर्धानो रेवत पावक शरवसे वि भाहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā no aghne samidhā vṛdhāno revat pāvaka śravase vi bhāhi ||
Translation: 9 Fed with our fuel, purifying Agni, so blaze to us auspiciously for glory.

Sanskit Text: तन नो मित्रो वरुणो मामहन्ताम अदितिः सिन्धुः पर्थ्विवी उतो दयौः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthvivī uto dyauḥ ||
Translation: This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: अप नः शोशुचदघमग्ने शुशुग्ध्या रयिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa naḥ śośucadaghamaghne śuśughdhyā rayim |
Translation: 1. CHASING with light our sin away, O Agni, shine thou wealth on us.

Sanskit Text: अप नः शोशुचदघम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa naḥ śośucadagham ||
Translation: May his light chase our sin away.

Sanskit Text: सुक्षेत्रिया सुगातुया वसूया च यजामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sukṣetriyā sughātuyā vasūyā ca yajāmahe |
Translation: 2 For goodly fields, for pleasant homes, for wealth we sacrifice to thee.
May his light chase our sin away.

Sanskit Text: पर यद भन्दिष्ठ एषां परास्माकासश्च सूरयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yad bhandiṣṭha eṣāṃ prāsmākāsaśca sūrayaḥ |
Translation: 3 Best praiser of all these be he; foremost, our chiefs who sacrifice.
May his light chase our sin away.

Sanskit Text: पर यत ते अग्ने सूरयो जायेमहि पर ते वयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yat te aghne sūrayo jāyemahi pra te vayam |
Translation: 4 So that thy worshippers and we, thine, Agni, in our sons may live.
May his light chase our sin away.

Sanskit Text: पर यदग्नेः सहस्वतो विश्वतो यन्ति भानवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yadaghneḥ sahasvato viśvato yanti bhānavaḥ |
Translation: 5 As ever-conquering Agni's beams of splendour go to every side,
May his light chase our sin away.

Sanskit Text: तवं हि विश्वतोमुख विश्वतः परिभूरसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hi viśvatomukha viśvataḥ paribhūrasi |
Translation: 6 To every side thy face is turned, thou art triumphant everywhere.
May his light chase our sin away.

Sanskit Text: दविषो नो विश्वतोमुखाति नावेव पारय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dviṣo no viśvatomukhāti nāveva pāraya |
Translation: 7 O thou whose face looks every way, bear us past foes as in a ship.
May his light chase our sin away.

Sanskit Text: स नः सिन्धुमिव नावयाति पर्षा सवस्तये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ sindhumiva nāvayāti parṣā svastaye |
Translation: 8 As in a ship, convey thou us for our advantage o’er the flood.
May his light chase our sin away.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानरस्य सुमतौ सयाम राजा हि कं भुवनानामभिश्रीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānarasya sumatau syāma rājā hi kaṃ bhuvanānāmabhiśrīḥ |
Translation: 1. STILL in Vaiśvānara's grace may we continue: yea, he is King supreme o’er all things living.

Sanskit Text: इतो जातो विश्वमिदं वि चष्टे वैश्वानरो यतते सूर्येण ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ito jāto viśvamidaṃ vi caṣṭe vaiśvānaro yatate sūryeṇa ||
Translation: Sprung hence to life upon this All he looketh. Vaiśvānara hath rivalry with Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: पर्ष्टो दिवि पर्ष्टो अग्निः पर्थिव्यां पर्ष्टो विश्वा ओषधीरा विवेश |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛṣṭo divi pṛṣṭo aghniḥ pṛthivyāṃ pṛṣṭo viśvā oṣadhīrā viveśa |
Translation: 2 Present in heaven, in earth, all-present Agni,—all plants that grow on ground hath he pervaded.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानरः सहसा पर्ष्टो अग्निः स नो दिवा स रिषः पातु नक्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānaraḥ sahasā pṛṣṭo aghniḥ sa no divā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam ||
Translation: May Agni, may Vaiśvānara with vigour, present, preserve us day and night from foemen.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानर तव तत सत्यमस्त्वस्मान रायो मघवानः सचन्ताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānara tava tat satyamastvasmān rāyo maghavānaḥ sacantām |
Translation: 3 Be this thy truth, Vaiśvānara, to us-ward: let wealth in rich abundance gather round us.

Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no ... ||
Translation: This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: जातवेदसे सुनवाम सोममरातीयतो नि दहाति वेदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jātavedase sunavāma somamarātīyato ni dahāti vedaḥ |
Translation: 1. FOR Jātavedas let us press the Soma: may he consume the wealth of the malignant.

Sanskit Text: स नः पर्षदति दुर्गाणि विश्वा नावेव सिन्धुं दुरितात्यग्निः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ parṣadati durghāṇi viśvā nāveva sindhuṃ duritātyaghniḥ ||
Translation: May Agni carry us through all our troubles, through grief as in a boat across the river.

Sanskit Text: स यो वर्षा वर्ष्ण्येभिः समोका महो दिवः पर्थिव्याश्चसम्राट |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa yo vṛṣā vṛṣṇyebhiḥ samokā maho divaḥ pṛthivyāścasamrāṭ |
Translation: 1. MAY he who hath his home with strength, the Mighty, the King supreme of earth and spacious heaven,

Sanskit Text: सतीनसत्वा हव्यो भरेषु मरुत्वान नो भवत्विन्द्र ऊती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satīnasatvā havyo bhareṣu marutvān no bhavatvindra ūtī ||
Translation: Lord of true power, to he invoked in battles,—may Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

Sanskit Text: यस्यानाप्तः सूर्यस्येव यामो भरे-भरे वर्त्रहा शुष्मो अस्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasyānāptaḥ sūryasyeva yāmo bhare-bhare vṛtrahā śuṣmo asti |
Translation: 2 Whose way is unattainable like Sūrya's: he in each fight is the strong Vṛtra-slayer,

Sanskit Text: वर्षन्तमः सखिभिः सवेभिरेवैर्म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣantamaḥ sakhibhiḥ svebhirevairma... ||
Translation: Mightiest with his Friends in his own courses. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

Sanskit Text: दिवो न यस्य रेतसो दुघानाः पन्थासो यन्ति शवसापरीताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo na yasya retaso dughānāḥ panthāso yanti śavasāparītāḥ |
Translation: 3 Whose paths go forth in their great might resistless, forthmilking, as it were, heaven's genial moisture.

Sanskit Text: तरद्द्वेषाः सासहिः पौंस्येभिर्म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taraddveṣāḥ sāsahiḥ pauṃsyebhirma... ||
Translation: With manly strength triumphant, foe-subduer,—may Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

Sanskit Text: सो अङगिरोभिरङगिरस्तमो भूद वर्षा वर्षभिः सखिभिः सखा सन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: so aṅghirobhiraṅghirastamo bhūd vṛṣā vṛṣabhiḥ sakhibhiḥ sakhā san |
Translation: 4 Among Aṅgirases he was the chiefest, a Friend with friends, mighty amid the mighty.

Sanskit Text: रग्मिभिर्र्ग्मी गातुभिर्ज्येष्ठो म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛghmibhirṛghmī ghātubhirjyeṣṭho ma... ||
Translation: Praiser mid praisers, honoured most of singers. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

Sanskit Text: स सूनुभिर्न रुद्रेभिर्र्भ्वा नर्षाह्ये सासह्वानमित्रान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sūnubhirna rudrebhirṛbhvā nṛṣāhye sāsahvānamitrān |
Translation: 5 Strong with the Rudras as with his own children, in manly battle conquering his foemen '

Sanskit Text: सनीळेभिः शरवस्यानि तूर्वन म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanīḷebhiḥ śravasyāni tūrvan ma... ||
Translation: With his close comrades doing deeds of glory,—may Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

Sanskit Text: स मन्युमीः समदनस्य कर्तास्माकेभिर्न्र्भिः सूर्यं सनत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa manyumīḥ samadanasya kartāsmākebhirnṛbhiḥ sūryaṃ sanat |
Translation: 6 Humbler of pride, exciter of the conflict, the Lord of heroes, God invoked of many,

Sanskit Text: अस्मिन्नहन सत्पतिः पुरुहूतो म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asminnahan satpatiḥ puruhūto ma... ||
Translation: May he this day gain with our men the sunlight. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

Sanskit Text: तमूतयो रणयञ्छूरसातौ तं कषेमस्य कषितयः कर्ण्वत तराम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamūtayo raṇayañchūrasātau taṃ kṣemasya kṣitayaḥ kṛṇvata trām |
Translation: 7 His help hath made him cheerer in the battle, the folk have made him guardian of their comfort.

Sanskit Text: स विश्वस्य करुणस्येश एको म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa viśvasya karuṇasyeśa eko ma... ||
Translation: Sole Lord is he of every holy service. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

Sanskit Text: तमप्सन्त शवस उत्सवेषु नरो नरमवसे तं धनाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamapsanta śavasa utsaveṣu naro naramavase taṃ dhanāya |
Translation: 8 To him the Hero, on high days of prowess, heroes for help and booty shall betake them.

Sanskit Text: सो अन्धे चित तमसि जयोतिर्विदन म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: so andhe cit tamasi jyotirvidan ma... ||
Translation: He hath found light even in the blinding darkness. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

Sanskit Text: स सव्येन यमति वराधतश्चित स दक्षिणे संग्र्भीता कर्तानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa savyena yamati vrādhataścit sa dakṣiṇe saṃghṛbhītā kṛtāni |
Translation: 9 He with his left hand checketh even the mighty, and with his right hand gathereth up the booty.

Sanskit Text: स कीरिणा चित सनिता धनानि म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa kīriṇā cit sanitā dhanāni ma... ||
Translation: Even with the humble he acquireth riches. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

Sanskit Text: स गरामेभिः सनिता स रथेभिर्विदे विश्वाभिः कर्ष्टिभिर्न्वद्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ghrāmebhiḥ sanitā sa rathebhirvide viśvābhiḥ kṛṣṭibhirnvadya |
Translation: 10 With hosts on foot and cars he winneth treasures: well is he known this day by all the people.

Sanskit Text: स पौंस्येभिरभिभूरशस्तीर्म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pauṃsyebhirabhibhūraśastīrma... ||
Translation: With manly might he conquereth those who hate him. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

Sanskit Text: स जामिभिर्यत समजाति मीळ्हे.अजामिभिर्वा पुरुहूत एवैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa jāmibhiryat samajāti mīḷhe.ajāmibhirvā puruhūta evaiḥ |
Translation: 11 When in his ways with kinsmen or with strangers he speedeth to the fight, invoked of many,

Sanskit Text: अपां तोकस्य तनयस्य जेषे म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāṃ tokasya tanayasya jeṣe ma... ||
Translation: For gain of waters, and of sons and grandsons, may Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

Sanskit Text: स वज्रभ्र्द दस्युहा भीम उग्रः सहस्रचेताः शतनीथर्भ्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vajrabhṛd dasyuhā bhīma ughraḥ sahasracetāḥ śatanīthaṛbhvā |
Translation: 12 Awful and fierce, fiend-slayer, thunder-wielder, with boundless knowledge, hymned by hundreds, mighty,

Sanskit Text: चम्रीषो न शवसा पाञ्चजन्यो म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: camrīṣo na śavasā pāñcajanyo ma... ||
Translation: In strength like Soma, guard of the Five Peoples, may Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

Sanskit Text: तस्य वज्रः करन्दति समत सवर्षा दिवो न तवेषो रवथःशिमीवान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya vajraḥ krandati smat svarṣā divo na tveṣo ravathaḥśimīvān |
Translation: 13 Winning the light, hitherward roars his thunder like the terrific mighty voice of Heaven.

Sanskit Text: तं सचन्ते सनयस्तं धनानि म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ sacante sanayastaṃ dhanāni ma... ||
Translation: Rich gifts and treasures evermore attend him. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

Sanskit Text: यस्याजस्रं शवसा मानमुक्थं परिभुजद रोदसी विश्वतः सीम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasyājasraṃ śavasā mānamukthaṃ paribhujad rodasī viśvataḥ sīm |
Translation: 14 Whose home eternal through his strength surrounds him on every side, his laud, the earth and heaven,

Sanskit Text: स पारिषत करतुभिर्मन्दसानो म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pāriṣat kratubhirmandasāno ma... ||
Translation: May he, delighted with our service, save us. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

Sanskit Text: न यस्य देवा देवता न मर्ता आपश्चन शवसो अन्तमापुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yasya devā devatā na martā āpaścana śavaso antamāpuḥ |
Translation: 15 The limit of whose power not Gods by Godhead, nor mortal men have reached, nor yet the Waters.

Sanskit Text: स पररिक्वा तवक्षसा कष्मो दिवश्च म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa prarikvā tvakṣasā kṣmo divaśca ma... ||
Translation: Both Earth and Heaven in vigour he surpasseth. May Indra, girt by Maruts, he our succour.

Sanskit Text: रोहिच्छ्यावा सुमदंशुर्ललामीर्द्युक्षा राय रज्राश्वस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rohicchyāvā sumadaṃśurlalāmīrdyukṣā rāya ṛjrāśvasya |
Translation: 16 The red and tawny mare, blaze-marked, high standing, celestial who, to bring Ṛjrāśva riches,

Sanskit Text: वर्षण्वन्तं बिभ्रती धूर्षु रथं मन्द्रा चिकेत नाहुषीषु विक्षु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣaṇvantaṃ bibhratī dhūrṣu rathaṃ mandrā ciketa nāhuṣīṣu vikṣu ||
Translation: Drew at the pole the chariot yoked with stallions, joyous, among the hosts of men was noted.

Sanskit Text: एतत तयत त इन्द्र वर्ष्ण उक्थं वार्षागिरा अभि गर्णन्ति राधः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etat tyat ta indra vṛṣṇa ukthaṃ vārṣāghirā abhi ghṛṇanti rādhaḥ |
Translation: 17 The Vārṣāgiras unto thee, O Indra, the Mighty One, sing forth this laud to please thee,

Sanskit Text: रज्राश्वः परष्टिभिरम्बरीषः सहदेवो भयमानः सुराधाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛjrāśvaḥ praṣṭibhirambarīṣaḥ sahadevo bhayamānaḥ surādhāḥ ||
Translation: Ṛjrāśva with his fellows, Ambarīṣa, Surādhas, Sahadeva, Bhayamāna.

Sanskit Text: दस्यूञ्छिम्यूंश्च पुरुहूत एवैर्हत्वा पर्थिव्यां शर्वा नि बर्हीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dasyūñchimyūṃśca puruhūta evairhatvā pṛthivyāṃ śarvā ni barhīt |
Translation: 18 He, much invoked, hath slain Dasyus and Śimyus, after his wont, and laid them low with arrows.

Sanskit Text: सनत कषेत्रं सखिभिः शवित्न्येभिः सनत्सूर्यं सनदपः सुवज्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanat kṣetraṃ sakhibhiḥ śvitnyebhiḥ sanatsūryaṃ sanadapaḥ suvajraḥ ||
Translation: The mighty Thunderer with his fair-complexioned friends won the land, the sunlight, and the waters.

Sanskit Text: विश्वाहेन्द्रो अधिवक्ता नो अस्त्वपरिह्व्र्ताः सनुयाम वाजम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāhendro adhivaktā no astvaparihvṛtāḥ sanuyāma vājam |
Translation: 19 May Indra evermore be our protector, and unimperilled may we win the booty.

Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no ... ||
Translation: This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: पर मन्दिने पितुमदर्चता वचो यः कर्ष्णगर्भा निरहन्न्र्जिश्वना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra mandine pitumadarcatā vaco yaḥ kṛṣṇagharbhā nirahannṛjiśvanā |
Translation: 1. SING, with oblation, praise to him who maketh glad, who with Ṛjiśvan drove the dusky brood away.

Sanskit Text: अवस्यवो वर्षणं वज्रदक्षिणं मरुत्वन्तं सख्याय हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avasyavo vṛṣaṇaṃ vajradakṣiṇaṃ marutvantaṃ sakhyāya havāmahe ||
Translation: Fain for help, him the strong whose right hand wields the bolt, him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

Sanskit Text: यो वयंसं जाह्र्षाणेन मन्युना यः शम्बरं यो अहन पिप्रुमव्रतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vyaṃsaṃ jāhṛṣāṇena manyunā yaḥ śambaraṃ yo ahan piprumavratam |
Translation: 2 Indra, who with triumphant wrath smote Vyaṁsa down, and Śambara, and Pipru the unrighteous one;

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो यः शुष्णमशुषं नयाव्र्णं म. .. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro yaḥ śuṣṇamaśuṣaṃ nyāvṛṇaṃ ma. .. ||
Translation: Who extirpated Śuṣṇa the insatiate,—him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

Sanskit Text: यस्य दयावाप्र्थिवी पौंस्यं महद यस्य वरते वरुणो यस्य सूर्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya dyāvāpṛthivī pauṃsyaṃ mahad yasya vrate varuṇo yasya sūryaḥ |
Translation: 3 He whose great work of manly might is heaven and earth, and Varuṇa and Sūrya keep his holy law;

Sanskit Text: यस्येन्द्रस्य सिन्धवः सश्चति वरतं म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasyendrasya sindhavaḥ saścati vrataṃ ma... ||
Translation: Indra, whose law the rivers follow as they flow,—him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

Sanskit Text: यो अश्वानां यो गवां गोपतिर्वशी य आरितः कर्मणि कर्मणि सथिरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo aśvānāṃ yo ghavāṃ ghopatirvaśī ya āritaḥ karmaṇi karmaṇi sthiraḥ |
Translation: 4 He who is Lord and Master of the steeds and kine, honoured—the firm and sure—at every holy act;

Sanskit Text: वीळोश्चिदिन्द्रो यो असुन्वतो वधो म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vīḷościdindro yo asunvato vadho ma... ||
Translation: Stayer even of the strong who pours no offering out,—him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

Sanskit Text: यो विश्वस्य जगतः पराणतस पतिर्यो बरह्मणे परथमो गा अविन्दत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo viśvasya jaghataḥ prāṇatas patiryo brahmaṇe prathamo ghā avindat |
Translation: 5 He who is Lord of all the world that moves and breathes, who for the Brahman first before all found the Cows;

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो यो दस्यून्रधरानवातिरन म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro yo dasyūnradharānavātiran ma... ||
Translation: Indra who cast the Dasyus down beneath his feet,—him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

Sanskit Text: यः शूरेभिर्हव्यो यश्च भीरुभिर्यो धावद्भिर्हूयते यश्च जिग्युभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ śūrebhirhavyo yaśca bhīrubhiryo dhāvadbhirhūyate yaśca jighyubhiḥ |
Translation: 6 Whom cowards must invoke and valiant men of war, invoked by those who conquer and by those who flee;

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं यं विश्वा भुवनाभि सन्दधुर्म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ yaṃ viśvā bhuvanābhi sandadhurma... ||
Translation: Indra, to whom all beings turn their constant thought,—him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

Sanskit Text: रुद्राणामेति परदिशा विचक्षणो रुद्रेभिर्योषा तनुते पर्थु जरयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rudrāṇāmeti pradiśā vicakṣaṇo rudrebhiryoṣā tanute pṛthu jrayaḥ |
Translation: 7 Refulgent in the Rudras’ region he proceeds, and with the Rudras through the wide space speeds the Dame.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं मनीषा अभ्यर्चति शरुतं म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ manīṣā abhyarcati śrutaṃ ma... ||
Translation: The hymn of praise extols Indra the far-renowned: him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

Sanskit Text: यद वा मरुत्वः परमे सधस्थे यद वावमे वर्जने मादयासे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā marutvaḥ parame sadhasthe yad vāvame vṛjane mādayāse |
Translation: 8 O girt by Maruts, whether thou delight thee in loftiest gathering-place or lowly dwelling,

Sanskit Text: अत आ याह्यध्वरं नो अछा तवाया हविश्चक्र्मा सत्यराधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ata ā yāhyadhvaraṃ no achā tvāyā haviścakṛmā satyarādhaḥ ||
Translation: Come thence unto our rite, true boon-bestower: through love of thee have we prepared oblations.

Sanskit Text: तवायेन्द्र सोमं सुषुमा सुदक्ष तवाया हविश्चक्र्मा बरह्मवाहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāyendra somaṃ suṣumā sudakṣa tvāyā haviścakṛmā brahmavāhaḥ |
Translation: 9 We, fain for thee, strong Indra, have pressed Soma, and, O thou sought with prayer, have made oblations.

Sanskit Text: अधा नियुत्वः सगणो मरुद्भिरस्मिन यज्ञे बर्हिषिमादयस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā niyutvaḥ saghaṇo marudbhirasmin yajñe barhiṣimādayasva ||
Translation: Now at this sacrifice, with all thy Maruts, on sacred grass, O team-borne God, rejoice thee.

Sanskit Text: मादयस्व हरिभिर्ये त इन्द्र वि षयस्व शिप्रे वि सर्जस्व धेने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mādayasva haribhirye ta indra vi ṣyasva śipre vi sṛjasva dhene |
Translation: 10 Rejoice thee with thine own Bay Steeds, O Indra, unclose thy jaws and let thy lips be open.

Sanskit Text: आ तवा सुशिप्र हरयो वहन्तूशन हव्यानि परति नो जुषस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tvā suśipra harayo vahantūśan havyāni prati no juṣasva ||
Translation: Thou with the fair cheek, let thy Bay Steeds bring thee: gracious to us, he pleased with our oblation.

Sanskit Text: मरुत्स्तोत्रस्य वर्जनस्य गोपा वयमिन्द्रेण सनुयाम वाजम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: marutstotrasya vṛjanasya ghopā vayamindreṇa sanuyāma vājam |
Translation: 11 Guards of the camp whose praisers are the Maruts, may we through Indra, get ourselves the booty.

Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no ... ||
Translation: This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: तत त इन्द्रियं परमं पराचैरधारयन्त कवयः पुरेदम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat ta indriyaṃ paramaṃ parācairadhārayanta kavayaḥ puredam |
Translation: 1. THAT highest Indra-power of thine is distant: that which is here sages possessed aforetime.

Sanskit Text: कषमेदमन्यद दिव्यन्यदस्य समी पर्च्यते समनेव केतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣamedamanyad divyanyadasya samī pṛcyate samaneva ketuḥ ||
Translation: This one is on the earth, in heaven the other, and both unite as flag with flag in battle.

Sanskit Text: स धारयत पर्थिवीं पप्रथच्च वज्रेण हत्वा निरपः ससर्ज |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa dhārayat pṛthivīṃ paprathacca vajreṇa hatvā nirapaḥ sasarja |
Translation: 2 He spread the wide earth out and firmly fixed it, smote with his thunderbolt and loosed the waters.

Sanskit Text: अहन्नहिमभिनद रौहिणं वयहन वयंसं मघवा शचीभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahannahimabhinad rauhiṇaṃ vyahan vyaṃsaṃ maghavā śacībhiḥ ||
Translation: Maghavan with his puissance struck down Ahi, rent Rauhiṇa to death and slaughtered Vyaṁsa.

Sanskit Text: स जातूभर्मा शरद्दधान ओजः पुरो विभिन्दन्नचरद विदासीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa jātūbharmā śraddadhāna ojaḥ puro vibhindannacarad vidāsīḥ |
Translation: 3 Armed with his bolt and trusting in his prowess he wandered shattering the forts of Dāsas.

Sanskit Text: विद्वान वज्रिन दस्यवे हेतिमस्यार्यं सहो वर्धया दयुम्नमिन्द्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidvān vajrin dasyave hetimasyāryaṃ saho vardhayā dyumnamindra ||
Translation: Cast thy dart, knowing, Thunderer, at the Dasyu; increase the Ārya's might and glory, Indra.

Sanskit Text: तदूचुषे मानुषेमा युगानि कीर्तेन्यं मघवा नाम बिभ्रत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadūcuṣe mānuṣemā yughāni kīrtenyaṃ maghavā nāma bibhrat |
Translation: 4 For him who thus hath taught these human races, Maghavan, bearing a fame-worthy title,

Sanskit Text: उपप्रयन दस्युहत्याय वज्री यद ध सूनुः शरवसे नाम दधे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upaprayan dasyuhatyāya vajrī yad dha sūnuḥ śravase nāma dadhe ||
Translation: Thunderer, drawing nigh to slay the Dasyus, hath given himself the name of Son for glory.

Sanskit Text: तदस्येदं पश्यता भूरि पुष्टं शरदिन्द्रस्य धत्तन वीर्याय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadasyedaṃ paśyatā bhūri puṣṭaṃ śradindrasya dhattana vīryāya |
Translation: 5 See this abundant wealth that he possesses, and put your trust in Indra's hero vigour.

Sanskit Text: स गा अविन्दत सो अविन्ददश्वान स ओषधीः सोपः स वनानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ghā avindat so avindadaśvān sa oṣadhīḥ soapaḥ sa vanāni ||
Translation: He found the cattle, and he found the horses, he found the plants, the forests and the waters.

Sanskit Text: भुरिकर्मणे वर्षभाय वर्ष्णे सत्यशुष्माय सुनवाम सोमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhurikarmaṇe vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe satyaśuṣmāya sunavāma somam |
Translation: 6 To him the truly strong, whose deeds are many, to him the strong Bull let us pour the Soma.

Sanskit Text: य आद्र्त्या परिपन्थीव शूरो.अयज्वनो विभजन्नेति वेदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya ādṛtyā paripanthīva śūro.ayajvano vibhajanneti vedaḥ ||
Translation: The Hero, watching like a thief in ambush, goes parting the possessions of the godless.

Sanskit Text: तदिन्द्र परेव वीर्यं चकर्थ यत ससन्तं वज्रेणाबोधयो.अहिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadindra preva vīryaṃ cakartha yat sasantaṃ vajreṇābodhayo.ahim |
Translation: 7 Well didst thou do that hero deed, O Indra, in waking with thy bolt the slumbering Ahi.

Sanskit Text: अनु तवा पत्नीर्ह्र्षितं वयश्च विश्वे देवासो अमदन्ननु तवा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu tvā patnīrhṛṣitaṃ vayaśca viśve devāso amadannanu tvā ||
Translation: in thee, delighted, Dames divine rejoiced them, the flying Maruts and all Gods were joyful.

Sanskit Text: शुष्णं पिप्रुं कुयवं वर्त्रमिन्द्र यदावधीर्वि पुरःशम्बरस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuṣṇaṃ pipruṃ kuyavaṃ vṛtramindra yadāvadhīrvi puraḥśambarasya |
Translation: 8 As thou hast smitten Śuṣṇa, Pipru, Vṛtra and Kuyava, and Śambara's forts

Sanskit Text: <font color="green" size="-1">
</font>
O Indra.

Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no ... ||
Translation: This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: योनिष ट इन्द्र निषदे अकारि तमा नि षीद सवानो नार्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yoniṣ ṭa indra niṣade akāri tamā ni ṣīda svāno nārvā |
Translation: 1. THE altar hath been made for thee to rest on: come like a panting courser and be seated.

Sanskit Text: विमुच्य वयो.अवसायाश्वान दोषा वस्तोर्वहीयसः परपित्वे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vimucya vayo.avasāyāśvān doṣā vastorvahīyasaḥ prapitve ||
Translation: Loosen thy flying Steeds, set free thy Horses who bear thee swiftly nigh at eve and morning.

Sanskit Text: ओ तये नर इन्द्रमूतये गुर्नू चित तान सद्यो अध्वनो जगम्यात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: o tye nara indramūtaye ghurnū cit tān sadyo adhvano jaghamyāt |
Translation: 2 These men have come to Indra for assistance: shall he not quickly come upon these pathways?

Sanskit Text: देवासो मन्युं दासस्य शचम्नन ते न आ वक्षन सुविताय वर्णम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāso manyuṃ dāsasya ścamnan te na ā vakṣan suvitāya varṇam ||
Translation: May the Gods quell the fury of the Dāsa, and may they lead our folk to happy fortune.

Sanskit Text: अव तमन भरते केतवेदा अव तमना भरते फेनमुदन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava tmana bharate ketavedā ava tmanā bharate phenamudan |
Translation: 3 He who hath only wish as his possession casts on himself, casts foam amid the waters.

Sanskit Text: कषीरेण सनातः कुयवस्य योषे हते ते सयातां परवणे शिफायाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣīreṇa snātaḥ kuyavasya yoṣe hate te syātāṃ pravaṇe śiphāyāḥ ||
Translation: Both wives of Kuyava in milk have bathed them: may they be drowned within the depth of Śiphā.

Sanskit Text: युयोप नाभिरुपरस्यायोः पर पूर्वाभिस्तिरते राष्टि शूरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuyopa nābhiruparasyāyoḥ pra pūrvābhistirate rāṣṭi śūraḥ |
Translation: 4 This hath his kinship checked who lives beside us: with ancient streams forth speeds and rules the Hero,

Sanskit Text: अञ्जसी कुलिशी वीरपत्नी पयो हिन्वाना उदभिर्भरन्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: añjasī kuliśī vīrapatnī payo hinvānā udabhirbharante ||
Translation: Añjasī, Kuliśī, and Virapatnī, delighting him, bear milk upon their waters.

Sanskit Text: परति यत सया नीथादर्शि दस्योरोको नाछा सदनं जानती गात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati yat syā nīthādarśi dasyoroko nāchā sadanaṃ jānatī ghāt |
Translation: 5 Soon as this Dasyu's traces were discovered, as she who knows her home, he sought the dwelling.

Sanskit Text: अध समा नो मघवञ्चर्क्र्तादिन मा नो मघेव निष्षपी परा दाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha smā no maghavañcarkṛtādin mā no magheva niṣṣapī parā dāḥ ||
Translation: Now think thou of us, Maghavan, nor cast us away as doth a profligate his treasure.

Sanskit Text: स तवं न इन्द्र सूर्ये सो अप्स्वनागास्त्व आ भज जीवशंसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvaṃ na indra sūrye so apsvanāghāstva ā bhaja jīvaśaṃse |
Translation: 6 Indra, as such, give us a share of sunlight, of waters, sinlessness, and reputation.

Sanskit Text: मान्तरां भुजमा रीरिषो नः शरद्धितं ते महत इन्द्रियाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: māntarāṃ bhujamā rīriṣo naḥ śraddhitaṃ te mahata indriyāya ||
Translation: Do thou no harm to our yet unborn offspring: our trust is in thy mighty Indra-power.

Sanskit Text: अधा मन्ये शरत ते अस्मा अधायि वर्षा चोदस्व महते धनाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā manye śrat te asmā adhāyi vṛṣā codasva mahate dhanāya |
Translation: 7 Now we, I think, in thee as such have trusted: lead us on, Mighty One, to ample riches.

Sanskit Text: मा नो अक्र्ते पुरुहूत योनाविन्द्र कषुध्यद्भ्यो वय आसुतिं दाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no akṛte puruhūta yonāvindra kṣudhyadbhyo vaya āsutiṃ dāḥ ||
Translation: In no unready house give us, O Indra invoked of many, food and drink when hungry.

Sanskit Text: मा नो वधीरिन्द्र मा परा दा मा नः परिया भोजनानि पर मोषीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no vadhīrindra mā parā dā mā naḥ priyā bhojanāni pra moṣīḥ |
Translation: 8 Slay us not, Indra; do not thou forsake us: steal not away the joys which we delight in.

Sanskit Text: आण्डा मा नो मघवञ्छक्र निर्भेन मा नः पात्रा भेत सहजानुषाणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āṇḍā mā no maghavañchakra nirbhen mā naḥ pātrā bhet sahajānuṣāṇi ||
Translation: Rend not our unborn brood, strong Lord of Bounty! our vessels with the life that is within them.

Sanskit Text: अर्वां एहि सोमकामं तवाहुरयं सुतस्तस्य पिबा मदाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāṃ ehi somakāmaṃ tvāhurayaṃ sutastasya pibā madāya |
Translation: 9 Come to us; they have called thee Soma-lover: here is the pressed juice. Drink thereof for rapture.

Sanskit Text: उरुव्यचा जथर आ वर्षस्व पितेव नः शर्णुहि हूयमानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uruvyacā jathara ā vṛṣasva piteva naḥ śṛṇuhi hūyamānaḥ ||
Translation: Widely-capacious, pour it down within thee, and, invocated, hear us like a Father.

Sanskit Text: चन्द्रमा अप्स्वन्तरा सुपर्णो धावते दिवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: candramā apsvantarā suparṇo dhāvate divi |
Translation: 1. WITHIN the waters runs the Moon, he with the beauteous wings in heaven.

Sanskit Text: न वो हिरण्यनेमयः पदं विन्दन्ति विद्युतो वित्तं मे अस्य रोदसी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na vo hiraṇyanemayaḥ padaṃ vindanti vidyuto vittaṃ me asya rodasī ||
Translation: Ye lightnings with your golden wheels, men find not your abiding-place. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: अर्थमिद वा उ अर्थिन आ जाया युवते पतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arthamid vā u arthina ā jāyā yuvate patim |
Translation: 2 Surely men crave and gain their wish. Close to her husband clings the wife.

Sanskit Text: तुञ्जाते वर्ष्ण्यं पयः परिदाय रसं दुहे वित्तम... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tuñjāte vṛṣṇyaṃ payaḥ paridāya rasaṃ duhe vittam... ||
Translation: And, in embraces intertwined, both give and take the bliss of love. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: मो षु देव अदः सवरव पादि दिवस परि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mo ṣu deva adaḥ svarava pādi divas pari |
Translation: 3 O never may that light, ye Gods, fall from its station in the sky.

Sanskit Text: मा सोम्यस्य शम्भुवः शूने भूम कदा चन वित्तम... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā somyasya śambhuvaḥ śūne bhūma kadā cana vittam... ||
Translation: Ne’er fail us one like Soma sweet, the spring of our felicity. Mark this my woe

Sanskit Text: <font color="green" size="-1">
</font>
ye Earth and Heaven.
यज्ञं पर्छाम्यवमं स तद दूतो वि वोचति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñaṃ pṛchāmyavamaṃ sa tad dūto vi vocati |
Translation: 4 I ask the last of sacrifice. As envoy he shall tell it forth.

Sanskit Text: कव रतं पूर्व्यं गतं कस्तद बिभर्ति नूतनो वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kva ṛtaṃ pūrvyaṃ ghataṃ kastad bibharti nūtano vi... ||
Translation: Where is the ancient law divine? Who is its new diffuser now? Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: अमी ये देवा सथन तरिष्वा रोचने दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: amī ye devā sthana triṣvā rocane divaḥ |
Translation: 5 Ye Gods who yonder have your home in the three lucid realms of heaven,

Sanskit Text: कद व रतं कदन्र्तं कव परत्ना व आहुतिर्वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kad va ṛtaṃ kadanṛtaṃ kva pratnā va āhutirvi... ||
Translation: What count ye truth and what untruth? Where is mine ancient call on you? Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: कद व रतस्य धर्णसि कद वरुणस्य चक्षणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kad va ṛtasya dharṇasi kad varuṇasya cakṣaṇam |
Translation: 6 What is your firm support of Law? What Varuṇa's observant eye?

Sanskit Text: कदर्यम्णो महस पथाति करामेम दूढ्यो वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadaryamṇo mahas pathāti krāmema dūḍhyo vi... ||
Translation: How may we pass the wicked on the path of mighty Aryaman? Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: अहम सो अस्मि यः पुरा सुते वदामि कानि चित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aham so asmi yaḥ purā sute vadāmi kāni cit |
Translation: 7 I am the man who sang of old full many a laud when Soma flowed.

Sanskit Text: तं मा वयन्त्याध्यो वर्को न तर्ष्णजं मर्गं वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ mā vyantyādhyo vṛko na tṛṣṇajaṃ mṛghaṃ vi... ||
Translation: Yet torturing cares consume me as the wolf assails the thirsty deer. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: सं मा तपन्त्यभितः सपत्नीरिव पर्शवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ mā tapantyabhitaḥ sapatnīriva parśavaḥ |
Translation: 8 Like rival wives on every side enclosing ribs oppress me sore.

Sanskit Text: मूषो न शिश्ना वयदन्ति माध्य सतोतारं ते शतक्रतो वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mūṣo na śiśnā vyadanti mādhya stotāraṃ te śatakrato vi... ||
Translation: O Śatakratu, biting cares devour me, singer of thy praise, as rats devour the weaver's threads. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: अमी ये सप्त रश्मयस्तत्रा मे नाभिरातता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: amī ye sapta raśmayastatrā me nābhirātatā |
Translation: 9 Where those seven rays are shining, thence my home and family extend.

Sanskit Text: तरितस्तद वेदाप्त्यः स जामित्वाय रेभति वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tritastad vedāptyaḥ sa jāmitvāya rebhati vi... ||
Translation: This Tṛta Āptya knoweth well, and speaketh out for brotherhood. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: अमी ये पञ्चोक्षणो मध्ये तस्थुर्महो दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: amī ye pañcokṣaṇo madhye tasthurmaho divaḥ |
Translation: 10 May those five Bulls which stand on high full in the midst of mighty heaven,

Sanskit Text: देवत्रा नु परवाच्यं सध्रीचीना नि वाव्र्तुर्वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devatrā nu pravācyaṃ sadhrīcīnā ni vāvṛturvi... ||
Translation: Having together swiftly borne my praises to the Gods, return. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: सुपर्णा एत आसते मध्य आरोधने दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suparṇā eta āsate madhya ārodhane divaḥ |
Translation: 11 High in the mid ascent of heaven those Birds of beauteous pinion sit.

Sanskit Text: ते सेधन्ति पथो वर्कं तरन्तं यह्वतीरपो वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te sedhanti patho vṛkaṃ tarantaṃ yahvatīrapo vi... ||
Translation: Back from his path they drive the wolf as he would cross the restless floods. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: नव्यं तदुक्थ्यं हितं देवासः सुप्रवाचनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: navyaṃ tadukthyaṃ hitaṃ devāsaḥ supravācanam |
Translation: 12 Firm is this new-wrought hymn of praise, and meet to be told forth, O Gods.

Sanskit Text: रतमर्षन्ति सिन्धवः सत्यं तातान सूर्यो वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtamarṣanti sindhavaḥ satyaṃ tātāna sūryo vi... ||
Translation: The flowing of the floods is Law, Truth is the Sun's extended light. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने तव तयदुक्थ्यं देवेष्वस्त्याप्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne tava tyadukthyaṃ deveṣvastyāpyam |
Translation: 13 Worthy of laud, O Agni, is that kinship which thou hast with Gods.

Sanskit Text: स नः सत्तो मनुष्वदा देवान यक्षि विदुष्टरो वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ satto manuṣvadā devān yakṣi viduṣṭaro vi... ||
Translation: Here seat thee like a man: most wise, bring thou the Gods for sacrifice. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: सत्तो होता मनुष्वदा देवानछा विदुष्टरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satto hotā manuṣvadā devānachā viduṣṭaraḥ |
Translation: 14 Here seated, man-like as a priest shall wisest Agni to the Gods

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्हव्या सुषूदति देवो देवेषु मेधिरो वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirhavyā suṣūdati devo deveṣu medhiro vi... ||
Translation: Speed onward our oblations, God among the Gods, intelligent. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: बरह्मा कर्णोति वरुणो गातुविदं तमीमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmā kṛṇoti varuṇo ghātuvidaṃ tamīmahe |
Translation: 15 Varuṇa makes the holy prayer. To him who finds the path we pray.

Sanskit Text: वयूर्णोति हर्दा मतिं नव्यो जायतां रतं वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyūrṇoti hṛdā matiṃ navyo jāyatāṃ ṛtaṃ vi... ||
Translation: He in the heart reveals his thought. Let sacred worship rise anew. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: असौ यः पन्था आदित्यो दिवि परवाच्यं कर्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asau yaḥ panthā ādityo divi pravācyaṃ kṛtaḥ |
Translation: 16 That pathway of the Sun in heaven, made to be highly glorified,

Sanskit Text: न स देवा अतिक्रमे तं मर्तासो न पश्यथ वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na sa devā atikrame taṃ martāso na paśyatha vi... ||
Translation: Is not to be transgressed, O Gods. O mortals, ye behold it not. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: तरितः कूपे.अवहितो देवान हवत ऊतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tritaḥ kūpe.avahito devān havata ūtaye |
Translation: 17 Tṛta, when buried in the well, calls on the Gods to succour him.

Sanskit Text: तच्छुश्राव बर्हस्पतिः कर्ण्वन्नंहूरणादुरु वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tacchuśrāva bṛhaspatiḥ kṛṇvannaṃhūraṇāduru vi... ||
Translation: That call of his Bṛhaspati heard and released him from distress. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: अरुणो मा सक्र्द वर्कः पथा यन्तं ददर्श हि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aruṇo mā sakṛd vṛkaḥ pathā yantaṃ dadarśa hi |
Translation: 18 A ruddy wolf beheld me once, as I was faring on my path.

Sanskit Text: उज्जिहीते निचाय्या तष्टेव पर्ष्ट्यामयी वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ujjihīte nicāyyā taṣṭeva pṛṣṭyāmayī vi... ||
Translation: He, like a carpenter whose back is aching crouched and slunk away. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: एनाङगूषेण वयमिन्द्रवन्तो.अभि षयाम वर्जने सर्ववीराः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: enāṅghūṣeṇa vayamindravanto.abhi ṣyāma vṛjane sarvavīrāḥ |
Translation: 19 Through this our song may we, allied with Indra, with all our heroes conquer in the battle.

Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no ... ||
Translation: This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं मित्रं वरुणमग्निमूतये मारुतं शर्धो अदितिंहवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ mitraṃ varuṇamaghnimūtaye mārutaṃ śardho aditiṃhavāmahe |
Translation: 1. CALL we for aid on Indra, Mitra, Varuṇa and Agni and the Marut host and Aditi.

Sanskit Text: रथं न दुर्गाद वसवः सुदानवो विश्वस्मान नोंहसो निष पिपर्तन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathaṃ na durghād vasavaḥ sudānavo viśvasmān noaṃhaso niṣ pipartana ||
Translation: Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

Sanskit Text: त आदित्या आ गता सर्वतातये भूत देवा वर्त्रतूर्येषु शम्भुवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta ādityā ā ghatā sarvatātaye bhūta devā vṛtratūryeṣu śambhuvaḥ |
Translation: 2 Come ye Ādityas for our full prosperity, in conquests of the foe, ye Gods, bring joy to us.

Sanskrit Transliteration: rathaṃ ... ||
Translation: Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

Sanskit Text: अवन्तु नः पितरः सुप्रवाचना उत देवी देवपुत्रे रताव्र्धा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avantu naḥ pitaraḥ supravācanā uta devī devaputre ṛtāvṛdhā |
Translation: 3 May the most glorious Fathers aid us, and the two Goddesses, Mothers of the Gods, who strengthen Law.

Sanskrit Transliteration: rathaṃ ... ||
Translation: Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

Sanskit Text: नराशंसं वाजिनं वाजयन्निह कषयद्वीरं पूषणं सुम्नैरीमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: narāśaṃsaṃ vājinaṃ vājayanniha kṣayadvīraṃ pūṣaṇaṃ sumnairīmahe |
Translation: 4 To mighty Narāśaṁsa, strengthening his might, to Pūṣan, ruler over men, we pray with hymns.

Sanskrit Transliteration: rathaṃ ... ||
Translation: Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पते सदमिन नः सुगं कर्धि शं योर्यत ते मनुर्हितं तदीमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspate sadamin naḥ sughaṃ kṛdhi śaṃ yoryat te manurhitaṃ tadīmahe |
Translation: 5 Bṛhaspati, make us evermore an easy path: we crave what boon thou hast for men in rest and stir.

Sanskrit Transliteration: rathaṃ ... ||
Translation: Like as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं कुत्सो वर्त्रहणं शचीपतिं काटे निबाळ्ह रषिरह्वदूतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ kutso vṛtrahaṇaṃ śacīpatiṃ kāṭe nibāḷha ṛṣirahvadūtaye |
Translation: 6 Sunk in the pit the Ṛṣi Kutsa called, to aid, Indra the Vṛtra-slayer, Lord of power and might.

Sanskrit Transliteration: rathaṃ ... ||
Translation: Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

Sanskit Text: देवैर्नो देव्यदितिर्नि पातु देवस्त्राता तरायतामप्रयुछन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devairno devyaditirni pātu devastrātā trāyatāmaprayuchan |
Translation: 7 May Aditi the Goddess guard us with the Gods: may the protecting God keep us with ceaseless care.

Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no ... ||
Translation: This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञो देवानां परत्येति सुम्नमादित्यासो भवता मर्ळयन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajño devānāṃ pratyeti sumnamādityāso bhavatā mṛḷayantaḥ |
Translation: 1. THE sacrifice obtains the Gods’ acceptance: be graciously inclined to us, Ādityas.

Sanskit Text: आ वो.अर्वाची सुमतिर्वव्र्त्यादंहोश्चिद या वरिवोवित्तरासत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vo.arvācī sumatirvavṛtyādaṃhościd yā varivovittarāsat ||
Translation: Hitherward let your favour be directed, and be our best deliverer from trouble.

Sanskit Text: उप नो देवा अवसा गमन्त्वङगिरसां सामभिः सतूयमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa no devā avasā ghamantvaṅghirasāṃ sāmabhiḥ stūyamānāḥ |
Translation: 2 By praise-songs of Aṅgirases exalted, may the Gods come to us with their protection.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र इन्द्रियैर्मरुतो मरुद्भिरादित्यैर्नो अदितिः शर्म यंसत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra indriyairmaruto marudbhirādityairno aditiḥ śarma yaṃsat ||
Translation: May Indra with his powers, Maruts with Maruts, Aditi with Ādityas grant us shelter.

Sanskit Text: तन न इन्द्रस्तद वरुणस्तदग्निस्तदर्यमा तत सविताचनो धात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan na indrastad varuṇastadaghnistadaryamā tat savitācano dhāt |
Translation: 3 This laud of ours may Varuṇa and Indra, Aryaman Agni, Savitar find pleasant.

Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no ... ||
Translation: This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: य इन्द्राग्नी चित्रतमो रथो वामभि विश्वानि भुवनानि चष्टे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya indrāghnī citratamo ratho vāmabhi viśvāni bhuvanāni caṣṭe |
Translation: 1. ON that most wondrous car of yours, O Indra and Agni, which looks round on all things living,

Sanskit Text: तेना यातं सरथं तस्थिवांसाथा सोमस्य पिबतं सुतस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tenā yātaṃ sarathaṃ tasthivāṃsāthā somasya pibataṃ sutasya ||
Translation: Take ye your stand and come to us together, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

Sanskit Text: यावदिदं भुवनं विश्वमस्त्युरुव्यचा वरिमता गभीरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāvadidaṃ bhuvanaṃ viśvamastyuruvyacā varimatā ghabhīram |
Translation: 2 As vast as all this world is in its compass, deep as it is, with its far-stretching surface,

Sanskit Text: तावानयं पातवे सोमो अस्त्वरमिन्द्राग्नी मनसे युवभ्याम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāvānayaṃ pātave somo astvaramindrāghnī manase yuvabhyām ||
Translation: So let this Soma be, Indra and Agni, made for your drinking till your soul be sated.

Sanskit Text: चक्राथे हि सध्र्यं नाम भद्रं सध्रीचीना वर्त्रहणाुत सथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakrāthe hi sadhryaṃ nāma bhadraṃ sadhrīcīnā vṛtrahaṇāuta sthaḥ |
Translation: 3 For ye have won a blessed name together: yea, with one aim ye strove, O Vṛtra-slayers.

Sanskit Text: ताविन्द्राग्नी सध्र्यञ्चा निषद्या वर्ष्णः सोमस्य वर्षणा वर्षेथाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāvindrāghnī sadhryañcā niṣadyā vṛṣṇaḥ somasya vṛṣaṇā vṛṣethām ||
Translation: So Indra-Agni, seated here together, pour in, ye Mighty Ones, the mighty Soma.

Sanskit Text: समिद्धेष्वग्निष्वानजाना यतस्रुचा बर्हिरु तिस्तिराणा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samiddheṣvaghniṣvānajānā yatasrucā barhiru tistirāṇā |
Translation: 4 Both stand adorned, when fires are duly kindled, spreading the sacred grass, with lifted ladles.

Sanskit Text: तीव्रैः सोमैः परिषिक्तेभिरर्वागेन्द्राग्नी सौमनसाय यातम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tīvraiḥ somaiḥ pariṣiktebhirarvāghendrāghnī saumanasāya yātam ||
Translation: Drawn by strong Soma juice poured forth around us, come, Indra-Agni, and display your favour.

Sanskit Text: यानीन्द्राग्नी चक्रथुर्वीर्याणि यानि रूपाण्युत वर्ष्ण्यानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yānīndrāghnī cakrathurvīryāṇi yāni rūpāṇyuta vṛṣṇyāni |
Translation: 5 The brave deeds ye have done, Indra and Agni, the forms ye have displayed and mighty exploits,

Sanskit Text: या वां परत्नानि सख्या शिवानि तेभिः सोमस्य पिबतं सुतस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā vāṃ pratnāni sakhyā śivāni tebhiḥ somasya pibataṃ sutasya ||
Translation: The ancient and auspicious bonds of friendship,—for sake of these drink of the flowing Soma.

Sanskit Text: यदब्रवं परथमं वां वर्णानो.अयं सोमो असुरैर्नो विहव्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadabravaṃ prathamaṃ vāṃ vṛṇāno.ayaṃ somo asurairno vihavyaḥ |
Translation: 6 As first I said when choosing you, in battle we must contend with Asuras for this Soma.

Sanskit Text: तां सत्यां शरद्धामभ्या हि यातमथा सोमस्य पिबतं सुतस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāṃ satyāṃ śraddhāmabhyā hi yātamathā somasya pibataṃ sutasya ||
Translation: So came ye unto this my true conviction, and drank libations of the flowing Soma.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्राग्नी मदथः सवे दुरोणे यद बरह्मणि राजनि वायजत्रा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindrāghnī madathaḥ sve duroṇe yad brahmaṇi rājani vāyajatrā |
Translation: 7 If in your dwelling, or with prince or Brahman, ye, Indra-Agni, Holy Ones, rejoice you,

Sanskit Text: अतः परि वर्षणावा हि यातमथा सोमस्य पिबतं सुतस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ataḥ pari vṛṣaṇāvā hi yātamathā somasya pibataṃ sutasya ||
Translation: Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libation of the flowing Soma.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्राग्नी यदुषु तुर्वशेषु यद दरुह्युष्वनुषु पूरुषु सथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindrāghnī yaduṣu turvaśeṣu yad druhyuṣvanuṣu pūruṣu sthaḥ |
Translation: 8 If with, the Yadus, Turvaśas, ye sojourn, with Druhyus, Anus, Pūrus, Indra-Agni!

Sanskrit Transliteration: ataḥ ... ||
Translation: Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्राग्नी अवमस्यां पर्थिव्यां मध्यमस्यां परमस्यामुत सथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindrāghnī avamasyāṃ pṛthivyāṃ madhyamasyāṃ paramasyāmuta sthaḥ |
Translation: 9 Whether, O Indra-Agni, ye be dwelling in lowest earth, in central, or in highest.

Sanskrit Transliteration: ataḥ ... ||
Translation: Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्राग्नी परमस्यां पर्थिव्यां मध्यमस्यामवमस्यामुत सथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindrāghnī paramasyāṃ pṛthivyāṃ madhyamasyāmavamasyāmuta sthaḥ |
Translation: 10 Whether, O Indra-Agni, ye be dwelling in highest earth, in central, or in lowest,

Sanskrit Transliteration: ataḥ ... ||
Translation: Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्राग्नी दिवि षठो यत पर्थिव्यां यत पर्वतेष्वोषधीष्वप्सु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindrāghnī divi ṣṭho yat pṛthivyāṃ yat parvateṣvoṣadhīṣvapsu |
Translation: 11 Whether ye be in heaven, O Indra-Agni, on earth, on mountains, in the herbs, or waters,

Sanskrit Transliteration: ataḥ ... ||
Translation: Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्राग्नी उदिता सूर्यस्य मध्ये दिवः सवधया मादयेथे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindrāghnī uditā sūryasya madhye divaḥ svadhayā mādayethe |
Translation: 12 If, when the Sun to the mid-heaven hath mounted, ye take delight in food, O Indra-Agni,

Sanskrit Transliteration: ataḥ ... ||
Translation: Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

Sanskit Text: एवेन्द्राग्नी पपिवांसा सुतस्य विश्वास्मभ्यं सं जयतन्धनानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evendrāghnī papivāṃsā sutasya viśvāsmabhyaṃ saṃ jayatandhanāni |
Translation: 13 Thus having drunk your fill of our libation, win us all kinds of wealth, Indra and Agni.

Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no ... ||
Translation: This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: वि हयख्यं मनसा वस्य इछन्निन्द्राग्नी जञास उत वा सजातान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi hyakhyaṃ manasā vasya ichannindrāghnī jñāsa uta vā sajātān |
Translation: 1. LONGING for weal I looked around, in spirit, for kinsmen, Indra-Agni, or for brothers.

Sanskit Text: नान्या युवत परमतिरस्ति मह्यं स वां धियं वाजयन्तीमतक्षम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nānyā yuvat pramatirasti mahyaṃ sa vāṃ dhiyaṃ vājayantīmatakṣam ||
Translation: No providence but yours alone is with me so have I wrought for you this hymn for succour.

Sanskit Text: अश्रवं हि भूरिदावत्तरा वां विजामातुरुत वा घा सयालात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśravaṃ hi bhūridāvattarā vāṃ vijāmāturuta vā ghā syālāt |
Translation: 2 For I have heard that ye give wealth more freely than worthless son-in-law or spouse's brother.

Sanskit Text: अथा सोमस्य परयती युवभ्यामिन्द्राग्नी सतोमं जनयामि नव्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā somasya prayatī yuvabhyāmindrāghnī stomaṃ janayāmi navyam ||
Translation: So offering to you this draught of Soma, I make you this new hymn, Indra and Agni,

Sanskit Text: मा छेद्म रश्मीन्रिति नाधमानाः पितॄणां शक्तीरनुयछमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā chedma raśmīnriti nādhamānāḥ pitṝṇāṃ śaktīranuyachamānāḥ |
Translation: 3 Let us not break the cords: with this petition we strive to gain the powers of our forefathers.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्निभ्यां कं वर्षणो मदन्ति ता हयद्री धिषणाया उपस्थे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnibhyāṃ kaṃ vṛṣaṇo madanti tā hyadrī dhiṣaṇāyā upasthe ||
Translation: For Indra-Agni the strong drops are joyful, for here in the bowl's lap are both the press-stones.

Sanskit Text: युवाभ्यां देवी धिषणा मदायेन्द्राग्नी सोममुशती सुनोति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvābhyāṃ devī dhiṣaṇā madāyendrāghnī somamuśatī sunoti |
Translation: 4 For you the bowl divine, Indra and Agni, presses the Soma gladly to delight you.

Sanskit Text: तावश्विना भद्रहस्ता सुपाणी आ धावतं मधुना पर्ङकतमप्सु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāvaśvinā bhadrahastā supāṇī ā dhāvataṃ madhunā pṛṅktamapsu ||
Translation: With hands auspicious and fair arms, ye Aśvins, haste, sprinkle it with sweetness in the waters.

Sanskit Text: युवामिन्द्राग्नी वसुनो विभागे तवस्तमा शुश्रव वर्त्रहत्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvāmindrāghnī vasuno vibhāghe tavastamā śuśrava vṛtrahatye |
Translation: 5 You, I have heard, were mightiest, Indra-Agni, when Vṛtra fell and when the spoil was parted.

Sanskit Text: तावासद्या बर्हिषि यज्ञे अस्मिन पर चर्षणी मादयेथां सुतस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāvāsadyā barhiṣi yajñe asmin pra carṣaṇī mādayethāṃ sutasya ||
Translation: Sit at this sacrifice, ye ever active, on the strewn grass, and with the juice delight you.

Sanskit Text: पर चर्षणिभ्यः पर्तनाहवेषु पर पर्थिव्या रिरिचाथे दिवश्च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra carṣaṇibhyaḥ pṛtanāhaveṣu pra pṛthivyā riricāthe divaśca |
Translation: 6 Surpassing all men where they shout for battle, ye Twain exceed the earth and heaven in greatness.

Sanskit Text: पर सिन्धुभ्यः पर गिरिभ्यो महित्वा परेन्द्राग्नी विश्वा भुवनात्यन्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sindhubhyaḥ pra ghiribhyo mahitvā prendrāghnī viśvā bhuvanātyanyā ||
Translation: Greater are ye than rivers and than mountains, O Indra-Agni, and all things beside them.

Sanskit Text: आ भरतं शिक्षतं वज्रबाहू अस्मानिन्द्राग्नी अवतं शचीभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā bharataṃ śikṣataṃ vajrabāhū asmānindrāghnī avataṃ śacībhiḥ |
