Translation: 7 Bring wealth and give it, ye whose arms wield thunder: Indra and Agni, with your powers protect us.

Sanskit Text: इमे नु ते रश्मयः सूर्यस्य येभिः सपित्वं पितरो न आसन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime nu te raśmayaḥ sūryasya yebhiḥ sapitvaṃ pitaro na āsan ||
Translation: Now of a truth these be the very sunbeams wherewith our fathers were of old united.

Sanskit Text: पुरन्दरा शिक्षतं वज्रहस्तास्मानिन्द्राग्नी अवतं भरेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purandarā śikṣataṃ vajrahastāsmānindrāghnī avataṃ bhareṣu |
Translation: 8 Give, ye who shatter forts, whose hands wield thunder: Indra and Agni, save us in our battles.

Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no ... ||
Translation: This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: ततं मे अपस्तदु तायते पुनः सवादिष्ठा धीतिरुचथाय शस्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tataṃ me apastadu tāyate punaḥ svādiṣṭhā dhītirucathāya śasyate |
Translation: 1. THE holy work I wrought before is wrought again: my sweetest hymn is sung to celebrate your praise.

Sanskit Text: अयं समुद्र इह विश्वदेव्यः सवाहाक्र्तस्य समु तर्प्णुत रभवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ samudra iha viśvadevyaḥ svāhākṛtasya samu tṛpṇuta ṛbhavaḥ ||
Translation: Here, O ye Ṛbhus, is this sea for all the Gods: sate you with Soma offered with the hallowing word.

Sanskit Text: आभोगयं पर यदिछन्त ऐतनापाकाः पराञ्चो मम के चिदापयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ābhoghayaṃ pra yadichanta aitanāpākāḥ prāñco mama ke cidāpayaḥ |
Translation: 2 When, seeking your enjoyment onward from afar, ye, certain of my kinsmen, wandered on your way,

Sanskit Text: सौधन्वनासश्चरितस्य भूमनागछत सवितुर्दाशुषो गर्हम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saudhanvanāsaścaritasya bhūmanāghachata saviturdāśuṣo ghṛham ||
Translation: Sons of Sudhanvan, after your long journeying, ye came unto the home of liberal Savitar.

Sanskit Text: तत सविता वो.अम्र्तत्वामासुवदगोह्यं यच्छ्रवयन्त ऐतन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat savitā vo.amṛtatvāmāsuvadaghohyaṃ yacchravayanta aitana |
Translation: 3 Savitar therefore gave you immortality, because ye came proclaiming him whom naught can hide;

Sanskit Text: तयं चिच्चमसमसुरस्य भक्षणमेकं सन्तमक्र्णुता चतुर्वयम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tyaṃ ciccamasamasurasya bhakṣaṇamekaṃ santamakṛṇutā caturvayam ||
Translation: And this the drinking-chalice of the Asura, which till that time was one, ye made to be fourfold.

Sanskit Text: विष्ट्वी शमी तरणित्वेन वाघतो मर्तासः सन्तो अम्र्तत्वमानशुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viṣṭvī śamī taraṇitvena vāghato martāsaḥ santo amṛtatvamānaśuḥ |
Translation: 4 When they had served with zeal at sacrifice as priests, they, mortal as they were, gained immortality.

Sanskit Text: सौधन्वना रभवः सूरचक्षसः संवत्सरे समप्र्च्यन्त धीतिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saudhanvanā ṛbhavaḥ sūracakṣasaḥ saṃvatsare samapṛcyanta dhītibhiḥ ||
Translation: The Ṛbhus, children of Sudhanvan, bright as suns, were in a year's course made associate with prayers.

Sanskit Text: कषेत्रमिव वि ममुस्तेजनेनमेकं पात्रं रभवो जेहमानम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣetramiva vi mamustejanenamekaṃ pātraṃ ṛbhavo jehamānam |
Translation: 5 The Ṛbhus, with a rod measured, as ’twere a field, the single sacrificial chalice. wide of mouth,

Sanskit Text: उपस्तुता उपमं नाधमाना अमर्त्येषु शरव इछमानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upastutā upamaṃ nādhamānā amartyeṣu śrava ichamānāḥ ||
Translation: Lauded of all who saw, praying for what is best, desiring glorious fame among Immortal Gods.

Sanskit Text: आ मनीषामन्तरिक्षस्य नर्भ्यः सरुचेव घर्तं जुहवाम विद्मना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā manīṣāmantarikṣasya nṛbhyaḥ sruceva ghṛtaṃ juhavāma vidmanā |
Translation: 6 As oil in ladles, we through knowledge will present unto the Heroes of the firmament our hymn,—

Sanskit Text: तरणित्वा ये पितुरस्य सश्चिर रभवो वाजमरुहन दिवो रजः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taraṇitvā ye piturasya saścira ṛbhavo vājamaruhan divo rajaḥ ||
Translation: The Ṛbhus who came near with this great Father's speed, and rose to heaven's high sphere to eat the strengthening food.

Sanskit Text: रभुर्न इन्द्रः शवसा नवीयान रभुर्वाजेभिर्वसुभिर्वसुर्ददिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛbhurna indraḥ śavasā navīyān ṛbhurvājebhirvasubhirvasurdadiḥ |
Translation: 7 Ṛbhu to us is Indra freshest in his might, Ṛbhu with powers and wealth is giver of rich gifts.

Sanskit Text: युष्माकं देवा अवसाहनि परिये.अभि तिष्ठेमप्र्त्सुतीरसुन्वताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmākaṃ devā avasāhani priye.abhi tiṣṭhemapṛtsutīrasunvatām ||
Translation: Gods, through your favour may we on the happy day quell the attacks of those who pour no offerings forth.

Sanskit Text: निश्चर्मण रभवो गामपिंशत सं वत्सेनास्र्जता मातरं पुनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: niścarmaṇa ṛbhavo ghāmapiṃśata saṃ vatsenāsṛjatā mātaraṃ punaḥ |
Translation: 8 Out of a skin, O Ṛbhus, once ye formed a cow, and brought the mother close unto her calf again.

Sanskit Text: सौधन्वनासः सवपस्यया नरो जिव्री युवाना पितराक्र्णोतन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saudhanvanāsaḥ svapasyayā naro jivrī yuvānā pitarākṛṇotana ||
Translation: Sons of Sudhanvan, Heroes, with surpassing skill ye made your aged Parents youthful as before.

Sanskit Text: वाजेभिर्नो वाजसातावविड्ढ्य रभुमानिन्द्र चित्रमा दर्षि राधः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājebhirno vājasātāvaviḍḍhy ṛbhumānindra citramā darṣi rādhaḥ |
Translation: 9 Help us with strength where spoil is won, O Indra: joined with the Ṛbhus give us varied bounty.

Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no ... ||
Translation: This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: ईळे दयावाप्र्थिवी पूर्वचित्तये.अग्निं घर्मं सुरुचं यामन्निष्टये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īḷe dyāvāpṛthivī pūrvacittaye.aghniṃ gharmaṃ surucaṃ yāmanniṣṭaye |
Translation: 1 To give first thought to them, I worship Heaven and Earth, and Agni, fair bright glow, to hasten their approach.

Sanskit Text: याभिर्भरे कारमंशाय जिन्वथस्ताभिरू षु ऊतिभिरश्विना गतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirbhare kāramaṃśāya jinvathastābhirū ṣu ūtibhiraśvinā ghatam ||
Translation: Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids wherewith in fight ye speed the war-cry to the spoil.

Sanskit Text: युवोर्दानाय सुभरा असश्चतो रथमा तस्थुर्वचसं न मन्तवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvordānāya subharā asaścato rathamā tasthurvacasaṃ na mantave |
Translation: 2 Ample, unfailing, they have mounted as it were an eloquent car that ye may think of us and give.

Sanskit Text: याभिर्धियो.अवथःकर्मन्निष्टये ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirdhiyo.avathaḥkarmanniṣṭaye tābhir... ||
Translation: Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids wherewith ye help our thoughts to further holy acts.

Sanskit Text: युवं तासां दिव्यस्य परशासने विशां कषयथो अम्र्तस्यमज्मना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ tāsāṃ divyasya praśāsane viśāṃ kṣayatho amṛtasyamajmanā |
Translation: 3 Ye by the might which heavenly nectar giveth you are in supreme dominion Lords of all these folk.

Sanskit Text: याभिर्धेनुमस्वं पिन्वथो नरा ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirdhenumasvaṃ pinvatho narā tābhir... ||
Translation: Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids wherewith ye, Heroes, made the barren cow give milk.

Sanskit Text: याभिः परिज्मा तनयस्य मज्मना दविमाता तूर्षु तरणिर्विभूषति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ parijmā tanayasya majmanā dvimātā tūrṣu taraṇirvibhūṣati |
Translation: 4 The aids wherewith the Wanderer through his offspring's might, or the Two-Mothered Son shows swiftest mid the swift;

Sanskit Text: याभिस्त्रिमन्तुरभवद विचक्षणस्ताभिर.. . ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhistrimanturabhavad vicakṣaṇastābhir.. . ||
Translation: Wherewith the sapient one acquired his triple lore,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभी रेभं निव्र्तं सितमद्भ्य उद वन्दनमैरयतं सवर्द्र्शे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhī rebhaṃ nivṛtaṃ sitamadbhya ud vandanamairayataṃ svardṛśe |
Translation: 5 Wherewith ye raised from waters, prisoned and fast bound, Rebha, and Vandana to look upon the light;

Sanskit Text: याभिः कण्वं पर सिषासन्तमावतं ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ kaṇvaṃ pra siṣāsantamāvataṃ tābhir... ||
Translation: Wherewith ye succoured Kaṇva as he strove to win,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभिरन्तकं जसमानमारणे भुज्यं याभिरव्यथिभिर्जिजिन्वथुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirantakaṃ jasamānamāraṇe bhujyaṃ yābhiravyathibhirjijinvathuḥ |
Translation: 6 Wherewith ye rescued Antaka when languishing deep in the pit, and Bhujyu with unfailing help.

Sanskit Text: याभिः कर्कन्धुं वय्यं च जिन्वथस्ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ karkandhuṃ vayyaṃ ca jinvathastābhir... ||
Translation: And comforted Karkandhu, Vayya, in their woe,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभिः शुचन्तिं धनसां सुषंसदं तप्तं घर्ममोम्यावन्तमत्रये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ śucantiṃ dhanasāṃ suṣaṃsadaṃ taptaṃ gharmamomyāvantamatraye |
Translation: 7 Wherewith ye gave Śucanti wealth and happy home, and made the fiery pit friendly for Atri's sake;

Sanskit Text: याभिः पर्ष्निगुं पुरुकुत्समावतं ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ pṛṣnighuṃ purukutsamāvataṃ tābhir... ||
Translation: Wherewith ye guarded Purukutsa, Pṛśnigu,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvin;, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभिः शचीभिर्व्र्षणा पराव्र्जं परान्धं शरोणं चक्षस एतवे कर्थः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ śacībhirvṛṣaṇā parāvṛjaṃ prāndhaṃ śroṇaṃ cakṣasa etave kṛthaḥ |
Translation: 8 Mighty Ones, with what powers ye gave Parāvṛj aid what time ye made the blind and lame to see and walk;

Sanskit Text: याभिर्वर्तिकां गरसिताममुञ्चतन्ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirvartikāṃ ghrasitāmamuñcatantābhir... ||
Translation: Wherewith ye set at liberty the swallowed quail,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभिः सिन्धुं मधुमन्तमसश्चतं वसिष्ठं याभिरजरावजिन्वतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ sindhuṃ madhumantamasaścataṃ vasiṣṭhaṃ yābhirajarāvajinvatam |
Translation: 9 Wherewith ye quickened the most sweet exhaustless flood, and comforted Vasiṣṭha, ye who ne’er decay;

Sanskit Text: याभिः कुत्सं शरुतर्यं नर्यमावतं ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ kutsaṃ śrutaryaṃ naryamāvataṃ tābhir... ||
Translation: And to Śrutarya, Kutsa, Narya gave your help,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभिर्विश्पलां धनसामथर्व्यं सहस्रमीळ्ह आजावजिन्वतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirviśpalāṃ dhanasāmatharvyaṃ sahasramīḷha ājāvajinvatam |
Translation: 10 Wherewith ye helped, in battle of a thousand spoils, Viśpalā seeking booty, powerless to move.

Sanskit Text: याभिर्वशमश्व्यं परेणिमावतं ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirvaśamaśvyaṃ preṇimāvataṃ tābhir... ||
Translation: Wherewith ye guarded friendly Vaśa, Aśva's son,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभिः सुदानू औशिजाय वणिजे दीर्घश्रवसे मधु कोशोक्षरत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ sudānū auśijāya vaṇije dīrghaśravase madhu kośoakṣarat |
Translation: 11 Whereby the cloud, ye Bounteous Givers, shed sweet rain for Dīrghaśravas, for the merchant Auśija,

Sanskit Text: कक्षीवन्तं सतोतारं याभिरावतं ताभिर. .. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kakṣīvantaṃ stotāraṃ yābhirāvataṃ tābhir. .. ||
Translation: Wherewith ye helped Kakṣīvān, singer of your praise,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभी रसां कषोदसोद्नः पिपिन्वथुरनश्वं याभी रथमावतं जिषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhī rasāṃ kṣodasodnaḥ pipinvathuranaśvaṃ yābhī rathamāvataṃ jiṣe |
Translation: 12 Wherewith ye made Rasā swell full with water-floods, and urged to victory the car without a horse;

Sanskit Text: याभिस्त्रिशोक उस्रिया उदाजत ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhistriśoka usriyā udājata tābhir... ||
Translation: Wherewith Triśoka drove forth his recovered cows,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभिः सूर्यं परियाथः परावति मन्धातारं कषैत्रपत्येष्वावतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ sūryaṃ pariyāthaḥ parāvati mandhātāraṃ kṣaitrapatyeṣvāvatam |
Translation: 13 Wherewith ye, compass round the Sun when far away, strengthened Mandhātar in his tasks as lord of lands,

Sanskit Text: याभिर्विप्रं पर भरद्वाजमावतं ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirvipraṃ pra bharadvājamāvataṃ tābhir... ||
Translation: And to sage Bharadvāja gave protecting help,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभिर्महामतिथिग्वं कशोजुवं दिवोदासं शम्बरहत्यावतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirmahāmatithighvaṃ kaśojuvaṃ divodāsaṃ śambarahatyaāvatam |
Translation: 14 Wherewith, when Śambara was slain, ye guarded well great Atithigva, Divodāsa, Kaśoju,

Sanskit Text: याभिः पूर्भिद्ये तरसदस्युमावतं ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ pūrbhidye trasadasyumāvataṃ tābhir... ||
Translation: And Trasadasyu when the forts were shattered down,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभिर्वम्रं विपिपानमुपस्तुतं कलिं याभिर्वित्तजानिं दुवस्यथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirvamraṃ vipipānamupastutaṃ kaliṃ yābhirvittajāniṃ duvasyathaḥ |
Translation: 15 Wherewith ye honoured the great drinker Vamra, and Upastuta and Kali when he gained his wife,

Sanskit Text: याभिर्व्यश्वमुत पर्थिमावतं ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirvyaśvamuta pṛthimāvataṃ tābhir... ||
Translation: And lent to Vyaśva and to Pṛthi favouring help,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभिर्नरा शयवे याभिरत्रये याभिः पुरा मनवे गातुमीषथुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirnarā śayave yābhiratraye yābhiḥ purā manave ghātumīṣathuḥ |
Translation: 16 Wherewith, O Heroes, ye vouchsafed deliverance to Śayu, Atri, and to Manu long ago;

Sanskit Text: याभिः शारीराजतं सयूमरश्मये ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ śārīrājataṃ syūmaraśmaye tābhir... ||
Translation: Wherewith ye shot your shafts in Syūmaraśmi's cause.—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभिः पठर्वा जठरस्य मज्मनाग्निर्नादीदेच्चित इद्धो अज्मन्ना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ paṭharvā jaṭharasya majmanāghnirnādīdeccita iddho ajmannā |
Translation: 17 Wherewith Paṭharvā, in his majesty of form, shone in his course like to a gathered kindled fire;

Sanskit Text: याभिः शर्यातमवथो महाधने ताभिर.. . ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ śaryātamavatho mahādhane tābhir.. . ||
Translation: Wherewith ye helped Śāryāta in the mighty fray,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभिरङगिरो मनसा निरण्यथो.अग्रं गछथो विवरे गोर्णसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiraṅghiro manasā niraṇyatho.aghraṃ ghachatho vivare ghoarṇasaḥ |
Translation: 18 Wherewith, Aṅgirases! ye triumphed in your heart, and onward went to liberate the flood of milk;

Sanskit Text: याभिर्मनुं शूरमिषा समावतं ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirmanuṃ śūramiṣā samāvataṃ tābhir... ||
Translation: Wherewith ye helped the hero Manu with new strength,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभिः पत्नीर्विमदाय नयूहथुरा घ वा याभिररुणीरशिक्षतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ patnīrvimadāya nyūhathurā gha vā yābhiraruṇīraśikṣatam |
Translation: 19 Wherewith ye brought a wife for Vimada to wed, wherewith ye freely gave the ruddy cows away;

Sanskit Text: याभिः सुदास ऊहथुः सुदेव्यं ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ sudāsa ūhathuḥ sudevyaṃ tābhir... ||
Translation: Wherewith ye brought the host of kind Gods to Sudās—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभिः शन्ताती भवथो ददाशुषे भुज्युं याभिरवथो याभिरध्रिगुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ śantātī bhavatho dadāśuṣe bhujyuṃ yābhiravatho yābhiradhrighum |
Translation: 20 Wherewith ye bring great bliss to him who offers gifts, wherewith ye have protected Bhujyu, Adhrigu,

Sanskit Text: ओम्यावतीं सुभरां रतस्तुभं ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: omyāvatīṃ subharāṃ ṛtastubhaṃ tābhir... ||
Translation: And good and gracious Subharā and Ṛtastup,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभिः कर्शानुमसने दुवस्यथो जवे याभिर्यूनो अर्वन्तमावतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ kṛśānumasane duvasyatho jave yābhiryūno arvantamāvatam |
Translation: 21 Wherewith ye served Kṛśānu where the shafts were shot, and helped the young man's horse to swiftness in the race;

Sanskit Text: मधु परियं भरथो यत सरड्भ्यस्ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhu priyaṃ bharatho yat saraḍbhyastābhir... ||
Translation: Wherewith ye bring delicious honey to the bees,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभिर्नरं गोषुयुधं नर्षाह्ये कषेत्रस्य साता तनयस्य जिन्वथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirnaraṃ ghoṣuyudhaṃ nṛṣāhye kṣetrasya sātā tanayasya jinvathaḥ |
Translation: 22 Wherewith ye speed the hero as he fights for kine in hero battle, in the strife for land and sons,

Sanskit Text: याभी रथानवथो याभिरर्वतस्ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhī rathānavatho yābhirarvatastābhir... ||
Translation: Wherewith ye safely guard his horses and his car,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins with those aids.

Sanskit Text: याभिः कुत्समार्जुनेयं शतक्रतू पर तुर्वीतिं पर च दभीतिमावतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ kutsamārjuneyaṃ śatakratū pra turvītiṃ pra ca dabhītimāvatam |
Translation: 23 Wherewith ye, Lords of Hundred Powers, helped Kutsa, son of Ārjuni, gave Turvīti and Dabhīti strength,

Sanskit Text: याभिर्ध्वसन्तिं पुरुषन्तिमावतं ताभिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirdhvasantiṃ puruṣantimāvataṃ tābhir... ||
Translation: Favoured Dhvasanti and lent Puruṣanti help,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

Sanskit Text: अप्नस्वतीमश्विना वाचमस्मे कर्तं नो दस्रा वर्षणा मनीषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apnasvatīmaśvinā vācamasme kṛtaṃ no dasrā vṛṣaṇā manīṣām |
Translation: 24 Make ye our speech effectual, O ye Aśvins, and this our hymn, ye mighty Wonder-Workers.

Sanskit Text: अद्यूत्ये.अवसे नि हवये वां वर्धे च नो भवतं वाजसातौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adyūtye.avase ni hvaye vāṃ vṛdhe ca no bhavataṃ vājasātau ||
Translation: In luckless game I call on you for succour: strengthen us also on the field of battle.

Sanskit Text: दयुभिरक्तुभिः परि पातमस्मानरिष्टेभिरश्विना सौभगेभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyubhiraktubhiḥ pari pātamasmānariṣṭebhiraśvinā saubhaghebhiḥ |
Translation: 25 With, undiminished blessings, O ye Aśvins, for evermore both night and day protect us.

Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no ... ||
Translation: This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: इदं शरेष्ठं जयोतिषां जयोतिरागाच्चित्रः परकेतो अजनिष्ट विभ्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ jyotiṣāṃ jyotirāghāccitraḥ praketo ajaniṣṭa vibhvā |
Translation: 1. This light is come, amid all lights the fairest; born is the brilliant, far-extending brightness.

Sanskit Text: यथा परसूता सवितुः सवयमेवा रात्र्युषसे योनिमारैक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā prasūtā savituḥ savayamevā rātryuṣase yonimāraik ||
Translation: Night, sent away for Savitar's uprising, hath yielded up a birth-place for the Morning.

Sanskit Text: रुशद्वत्सा रुशती शवेत्यागादारैगु कर्ष्णा सदनान्यस्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ruśadvatsā ruśatī śvetyāghādāraighu kṛṣṇā sadanānyasyāḥ |
Translation: 2 The Fair, the Bright is come with her white offspring; to her the Dark One hath resigned her dwelling.

Sanskit Text: समानबन्धू अम्र्ते अनुची दयावा वर्णं चरत आमिनाने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samānabandhū amṛte anucī dyāvā varṇaṃ carata āmināne ||
Translation: Akin, immortal, following each other, changing their colours both the heavens move onward.

Sanskit Text: समानो अध्वा सवस्रोरनन्तस्तमन्यान्या चरतो देवशिष्टे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samāno adhvā svasroranantastamanyānyā carato devaśiṣṭe |
Translation: 3 Common, unending is the Sisters' pathway; taught by the Gods, alternately they travel.

Sanskit Text: न मेथेते न तस्थतुः सुमेके नक्तोषासा समनसा विरूपे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na methete na tasthatuḥ sumeke naktoṣāsā samanasā virūpe ||
Translation: Fair-formed, of different hues and yet one-minded, Night and Dawn clash not, neither do they travel.

Sanskit Text: भास्वती नेत्री सून्र्तानामचेति चित्रा वि दुरो न आवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhāsvatī netrī sūnṛtānāmaceti citrā vi duro na āvaḥ |
Translation: 4 Bright leader of glad sounds, our eyes behold her; splendid in hue she hath unclosed the portals.

Sanskit Text: परार्प्या जगद वयु नो रायो अख्यदुषा अजीगर्भुवनानि विश्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prārpyā jaghad vyu no rāyo akhyaduṣā ajīgharbhuvanāni viśvā ||
Translation: She, stirring up the world, hath shown us riches: Dawn hath awakened every living creature.

Sanskit Text: जिह्मश्ये चरितवे मघोन्याभोगय इष्टये राय उ तवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jihmaśye caritave maghonyābhoghaya iṣṭaye rāya u tvam |
Translation: 5 Rich Dawn, she sets afoot the coiled-up sleeper, one for enjoyment, one for wealth or worship,

Sanskit Text: दभ्रं पश्यद्भ्य उर्विया विचक्ष उषा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dabhraṃ paśyadbhya urviyā vicakṣa uṣā ||
Translation: Those who saw little for extended vision. All living creatures hath the Dawn awakened.

Sanskit Text: कषत्राय तवं शरवसे तवं महीया इष्टये तवमर्थमिवत्वमित्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣatrāya tvaṃ śravase tvaṃ mahīyā iṣṭaye tvamarthamivatvamityai |
Translation: 6 One to high sway, one to exalted glory, one to pursue his gain, and one his labour:

Sanskit Text: विसद्र्शा जीविताभिप्रचक्ष उषा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: visadṛśā jīvitābhipracakṣa uṣā ... ||
Translation: All to regard their different vocations, all moving creatures hath the Dawn awakened.

Sanskit Text: एषा दिवो दुहिता परत्यदर्शि वयुछन्ती युवतिः शुक्रवासाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣā divo duhitā pratyadarśi vyuchantī yuvatiḥ śukravāsāḥ |
Translation: 7 We see her there, the Child of Heaven apparent, the young Maid, flushing in her shining raiment.

Sanskit Text: विश्वस्येशाना पार्थिवस्य वस्व उषो अद्येह सुभगेव्युछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvasyeśānā pārthivasya vasva uṣo adyeha subhaghevyucha ||
Translation: Thou sovran Lady of all earthly treasure, flush on us here, auspicious Dawn, this morning.

Sanskit Text: परायतीनामन्वेति पाथ आयतीनां परथमा शश्वतीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parāyatīnāmanveti pātha āyatīnāṃ prathamā śaśvatīnām |
Translation: 8 She first of endless morns to come hereafter, follows the path of morns that have departed.

Sanskit Text: वयुछन्ती जीवमुदीरयन्त्युषा मर्तं कं चन बोधयन्ती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyuchantī jīvamudīrayantyuṣā mṛtaṃ kaṃ cana bodhayantī ||
Translation: Dawn, at her rising, urges forth the living him who is dead she wakes not from his slumber.

Sanskit Text: उषो यदग्निं समिधे चकर्थ वि यदावश्चक्षसा सूर्यस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣo yadaghniṃ samidhe cakartha vi yadāvaścakṣasā sūryasya |
Translation: 9 As thou, Dawn, hast caused Agni to be kindled, and with the Sun's eye hast revealed creation.

Sanskit Text: यन मानुषान यक्ष्यमाणानजीगस्तद देवेषु चक्र्षे भद्रमप्नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yan mānuṣān yakṣyamāṇānajīghastad deveṣu cakṛṣe bhadramapnaḥ ||
Translation: And hast awakened men to offer worship, thou hast performed, for Gods, a noble service.

Sanskit Text: कियात्या यत समया भवाति या वयूषुर्याश्च नूनंव्युछान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kiyātyā yat samayā bhavāti yā vyūṣuryāśca nūnaṃvyuchān |
Translation: 10 How long a time, and they shall be together,—Dawns that have shone and Dawns to shine hereafter?

Sanskit Text: अनु पूर्वाः कर्पते वावशाना परदीध्याना जोषमन्याभिरेति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu pūrvāḥ kṛpate vāvaśānā pradīdhyānā joṣamanyābhireti ||
Translation: She yearns for former Dawns with eager longing, and goes forth gladly shining with the others.

Sanskit Text: ईयुष टे ये पूर्वतरामपश्यन वयुछन्तीमुषसं मर्त्यासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īyuṣ ṭe ye pūrvatarāmapaśyan vyuchantīmuṣasaṃ martyāsaḥ |
Translation: 11 Gone are the men who in the days before us looked on the rising of the earlier Morning.

Sanskit Text: अस्माभिरू नु परतिचक्ष्याभूदो ते यन्ति ये अपरीषु पश्यान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmābhirū nu praticakṣyābhūdo te yanti ye aparīṣu paśyān ||
Translation: We, we the living, now behold her brightness and they come nigh who shall hereafter see her.

Sanskit Text: यावयद्द्वेषा रतपा रतेजाः सुम्नावरी सून्र्ता ईरयन्ती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāvayaddveṣā ṛtapā ṛtejāḥ sumnāvarī sūnṛtā īrayantī |
Translation: 12 Foe-chaser, born of Law, the Law's protectress, joy-giver, waker of all pleasant voices,

Sanskit Text: सुमङगलीर्बिभ्रती देववीतिमिहाद्योषः शरेष्ठतमाव्युछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sumaṅghalīrbibhratī devavītimihādyoṣaḥ śreṣṭhatamāvyucha ||
Translation: Auspicious, bringing food for Gods’ enjoyment, shine on us here, most bright, O Dawn, this morning.

Sanskit Text: शश्वत पुरोषा वयुवास देव्यथो अद्येदं वयावो मघोनी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaśvat puroṣā vyuvāsa devyatho adyedaṃ vyāvo maghonī |
Translation: 13 From days eternal hath Dawn shone, the Goddess, and shows this light to-day, endowed with riches.

Sanskit Text: अथो वयुछादुत्तराननु दयूनजराम्र्ता चरति सवधाभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atho vyuchāduttarānanu dyūnajarāmṛtā carati svadhābhiḥ ||
Translation: So will she shine on days to come immortal she moves on in her own strength, undecaying.

Sanskit Text: वयञ्जिभिर्दिव आतास्वद्यौदप कर्ष्णां निर्णिजं देव्यावः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyañjibhirdiva ātāsvadyaudapa kṛṣṇāṃ nirṇijaṃ devyāvaḥ |
Translation: 14 In the sky's borders hath she shone in splendour: the Goddess hath thrown off the veil of darkness.

Sanskit Text: परबोधयन्त्यरुणेभिरश्वैरोषा याति सुयुजा रथेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prabodhayantyaruṇebhiraśvairoṣā yāti suyujā rathena ||
Translation: Awakening the world with purple horses, on her well-harnessed chariot Dawn approaches.

Sanskit Text: आवहन्ती पोष्या वार्याणि चित्रं केतुं कर्णुते चेकिताना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvahantī poṣyā vāryāṇi citraṃ ketuṃ kṛṇute cekitānā |
Translation: 15 Bringing all life-sustaining blessings with her, showing herself she sends forth brilliant lustre.

Sanskit Text: ईयुषीणामुपमा शश्वतीनां विभातीनां परथमोषा वयश्वैत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: īyuṣīṇāmupamā śaśvatīnāṃ vibhātīnāṃ prathamoṣā vyaśvait ||
Translation: Last of the countless mornings that have vanished, first of bright morns to come hath Dawn arisen.

Sanskit Text: उदीर्ध्वं जीवो असुर्न आगादप परागात तम आ जयोतिरेति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udīrdhvaṃ jīvo asurna āghādapa prāghāt tama ā jyotireti |
Translation: 16 Arise! the breath, the life, again hath reached us: darkness hath passed away and light approacheth.

Sanskit Text: आरैक पन्थां यातवे सूर्यायागन्म यत्र परतिरन्त आयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āraik panthāṃ yātave sūryāyāghanma yatra pratiranta āyuḥ ||
Translation: She for the Sun hath left a path to travel we have arrived where men prolong existence.

Sanskit Text: सयूमना वाच उदियर्ति वह्नि सतवानो रेभ उषसो विभातीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: syūmanā vāca udiyarti vahni stavāno rebha uṣaso vibhātīḥ |
Translation: 17 Singing the praises of refulgent Mornings with his hymn's web the priest, the poet rises.

Sanskit Text: अद्या तदुछ गर्णते मघोन्यस्मे आयुर्नि दिदीहि परजावत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adyā taducha ghṛṇate maghonyasme āyurni didīhi prajāvat ||
Translation: Shine then to-day, rich Maid, on him who lauds thee, shine down on us the gift of life and offspring.

Sanskit Text: या गोमतीरुषसः सर्ववीरा वयुछन्ति दाशुषे मर्त्याय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā ghomatīruṣasaḥ sarvavīrā vyuchanti dāśuṣe martyāya |
Translation: 18 Dawns giving sons all heroes, kine and horses, shining upon the man who brings oblations,—

Sanskit Text: वायोरिव सून्र्तानामुदर्के ता अश्वदा अश्नवत सोमसुत्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāyoriva sūnṛtānāmudarke tā aśvadā aśnavat somasutvā ||
Translation: These let the Soma-presser gain when ending his glad songs louder than the voice of Vāyu.

Sanskit Text: माता देवानामदितेरनीकं यज्ञस्य केतुर्ब्र्हती वि भाहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mātā devānāmaditeranīkaṃ yajñasya keturbṛhatī vi bhāhi |
Translation: 19 Mother of Gods, Aditi's form of glory, ensign of sacrifice, shine forth exalted.

Sanskit Text: परशस्तिक्र्द बरह्मणे नो वयुछा नो जने जनय विश्ववारे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: praśastikṛd brahmaṇe no vyuchā no jane janaya viśvavāre ||
Translation: Rise up, bestowing praise on our devotion all-bounteous, make us chief among the people.

Sanskit Text: यच्चित्रमप्न उषसो वहन्तीजानाय शशमानाय भद्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaccitramapna uṣaso vahantījānāya śaśamānāya bhadram |
Translation: 20 Whatever splendid wealth the Dawns bring with them to bless the man who offers praise and worship,

Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no ... ||
Translation: Even that may Mitra, Varuṇa vouchsafe us, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: इमा रुद्राय तवसे कपर्दिने कषयद्वीराय पर भरामहे मतीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā rudrāya tavase kapardine kṣayadvīrāya pra bharāmahe matīḥ |
Translation: 1. To the strong Rudra bring we these our songs of praise, to him the Lord of Heroes with the braided hair,

Sanskit Text: यथा शमसद दविपदे चतुष्पदे विश्वं पुष्टंग्रामे अस्मिन्ननातुरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā śamasad dvipade catuṣpade viśvaṃ puṣṭaṃghrāme asminnanāturam ||
Translation: That it be well with all our cattle and our men, that in this village all be healthy and well-fed.

Sanskit Text: मर्ळा नो रुद्रोत नो मयस कर्धि कषयद्वीराय नमसा विधेमते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mṛḷā no rudrota no mayas kṛdhi kṣayadvīrāya namasā vidhemate |
Translation: 2 Be gracious unto us, O Rudra, bring us joy: thee, Lord of Heroes, thee with reverence will we serve.

Sanskit Text: यच्छं च योश्च मनुरायेजे पिता तदश्याम तवरुद्र परणीतिषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yacchaṃ ca yośca manurāyeje pitā tadaśyāma tavarudra praṇītiṣu ||
Translation: Whatever health and strength our father Manu won by sacrifice may we, under thy guidance, gain.

Sanskit Text: अश्याम ते सुमतिं देवयज्यया कषयद्वीरस्य तव रुद्र मीढ्वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśyāma te sumatiṃ devayajyayā kṣayadvīrasya tava rudra mīḍhvaḥ |
Translation: 3 By worship of the Gods may we, O Bounteous One, O Rudra, gain thy grace, Ruler of valiant men.

Sanskit Text: सुम्नायन्निद विशो अस्माकमा चरारिष्टवीरा जुहवाम ते हविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sumnāyannid viśo asmākamā carāriṣṭavīrā juhavāma te haviḥ ||
Translation: Come to our families, bringing them bliss: may we, whose heroes are uninjured, bring thee sacred gifts,

Sanskit Text: तवेषं वयं रुद्रं यज्ञसाधं वङकुं कविमवसे निह्वयामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tveṣaṃ vayaṃ rudraṃ yajñasādhaṃ vaṅkuṃ kavimavase nihvayāmahe |
Translation: 4 Hither we call for aid the wise, the wanderer, impetuous Rudra, perfecter of sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: आरे अस्मद दैव्यं हेळो अस्यतु सुमतिमिद वयमस्या वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āre asmad daivyaṃ heḷo asyatu sumatimid vayamasyā vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: May he repel from us the anger of the Gods: verily we desire his favourable grace.

Sanskit Text: दिवो वराहमरुषं कपर्दिनं तवेषं रूपं नमसा निह्वयामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo varāhamaruṣaṃ kapardinaṃ tveṣaṃ rūpaṃ namasā nihvayāmahe |
Translation: 5 Him with the braided hair we call with reverence down, the wild-boar of the sky, the red, the dazzling shape.

Sanskit Text: हस्ते बिभ्रद भेषजा वार्याणि शर्म वर्म छर्दिरस्मभ्यं यंसत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: haste bibhrad bheṣajā vāryāṇi śarma varma chardirasmabhyaṃ yaṃsat ||
Translation: May he, his hand filled full of sovran medicines, grant us protection, shelter, and a home secure.

Sanskit Text: इदं पित्रे मरुतामुच्यते वचः सवादोः सवादीयो रुद्राय वर्धनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ pitre marutāmucyate vacaḥ svādoḥ svādīyo rudrāya vardhanam |
Translation: 6 To him the Maruts’ Father is this hymn addressed, to strengthen Rudra's might, a song more sweet than sweet.

Sanskit Text: रास्वा च नो अम्र्त मर्तभोजनं तमने तोकाय तनयाय मर्ळ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāsvā ca no amṛta martabhojanaṃ tmane tokāya tanayāya mṛḷa ||
Translation: Grant us, Immortal One, the food which mortals eat: be gracious unto me, my seed, my progeny.

Sanskit Text: मा नो महान्तमुत मा नो अर्भकं मा न उक्षन्तमुत मान उक्षितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no mahāntamuta mā no arbhakaṃ mā na ukṣantamuta māna ukṣitam |
Translation: 7 O Rudra, harm not either great or small of us, harm not the growing boy, harm not the full-grown man.

Sanskit Text: मा नो वधीः पितरं मोत मातरं मा नः परियास्तन्वो रुद्र रीरिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no vadhīḥ pitaraṃ mota mātaraṃ mā naḥ priyāstanvo rudra rīriṣaḥ ||
Translation: Slay not a sire among us, slay no mother here, and to our own dear bodies, Rudra, do not harm.

Sanskit Text: मा नस्तोके तनये मा न आयौ मा नो गोषु मा नो अश्वेषुरीरिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā nastoke tanaye mā na āyau mā no ghoṣu mā no aśveṣurīriṣaḥ |
Translation: 8 Harm us not, Rudra, in our seed and progeny, harm us not in the living, nor in cows or steeds,

Sanskit Text: वीरान मा नो रुद्र भामितो वधीर्हविष्मन्तःसदमित तवा हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vīrān mā no rudra bhāmito vadhīrhaviṣmantaḥsadamit tvā havāmahe ||
Translation: Slay not our heroes in the fury of thy wrath. Bringing oblations evermore we call to thee.

Sanskit Text: उप ते सतोमान पशुपा इवाकरं रास्वा पितर्मरुतां सुम्नमस्मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa te stomān paśupā ivākaraṃ rāsvā pitarmarutāṃ sumnamasme |
Translation: 9 Even as a herdsman I have brought thee hymns of praise: O Father of the Maruts, give us happiness,

Sanskit Text: भद्रा हि ते सुमतिर्म्र्ळयत्तमाथा वयमव इत्ते वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadrā hi te sumatirmṛḷayattamāthā vayamava itte vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: Blessed is thy most favouring benevolence, so, verily, do we desire thy saving help.

Sanskit Text: आरे ते गोघ्नमुत पूरुषघ्नं कषयद्वीर सुम्नमस्मे तेस्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āre te ghoghnamuta pūruṣaghnaṃ kṣayadvīra sumnamasme teastu |
Translation: 10 Far be thy dart that killeth men or cattle: thy bliss be with us, O thou Lord of Heroes.

Sanskit Text: मर्ळा च नो अधि च बरूहि देवाधा च नः शर्म यछद्विबर्हाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mṛḷā ca no adhi ca brūhi devādhā ca naḥ śarma yachadvibarhāḥ ||
Translation: Be gracious unto us, O God, and bless us, and then vouchsafe us doubly-strong protection.

Sanskit Text: अवोचाम नमो अस्मा अवस्यवः शर्णोतु नो हवं रुद्रो मरुत्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avocāma namo asmā avasyavaḥ śṛṇotu no havaṃ rudro marutvān |
Translation: 11 We, seeking help, have spoken and adored him: may Rudra, girt by Maruts, hear our calling.

Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no ... ||
Translation: This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: चित्रं देवानामुदगादनीकं चक्षुर्मित्रस्य वरुणस्याग्नेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: citraṃ devānāmudaghādanīkaṃ cakṣurmitrasya varuṇasyāghneḥ |
Translation: 1. THE brilliant presence of the Gods hath risen, the eye of Mitra, Varuṇa and Agni.

Sanskit Text: आप्रा दयावाप्र्थिवी अन्तरिक्षं सूर्य आत्मा जगतस्तस्थुषश्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āprā dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣaṃ sūrya ātmā jaghatastasthuṣaśca ||
Translation: The soul of all that moveth not or moveth, the Sun hath filled the air and earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: सूर्यो देवीमुषसं रोचमानां मर्यो न योषामभ्येति पश्चात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūryo devīmuṣasaṃ rocamānāṃ maryo na yoṣāmabhyeti paścāt |
Translation: 2 Like as a young man followeth a maiden, so doth the Sun the Dawn, refulgent Goddess:

Sanskit Text: यत्रा नरो देवयन्तो युगानि वितन्वते परति भद्राय भद्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatrā naro devayanto yughāni vitanvate prati bhadrāya bhadram ||
Translation: Where pious men extend their generations, before the Auspicious One for happy fortune.

Sanskit Text: भद्रा अश्वा हरितः सूर्यस्य चित्रा एतग्वा अनुमाद्यासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadrā aśvā haritaḥ sūryasya citrā etaghvā anumādyāsaḥ |
Translation: 3 Auspicious are the Sun's Bay-coloured Horses, bright, changing hues, meet for our shouts of triumph.

Sanskit Text: नमस्यन्तो दिव आ पर्ष्ठमस्थुः परि दयावाप्र्थिवी यन्ति सद्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: namasyanto diva ā pṛṣṭhamasthuḥ pari dyāvāpṛthivī yanti sadyaḥ ||
Translation: Bearing our prayers, the sky's ridge have they mounted, and in a moment speed round earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: तत सूर्यस्य देवत्वं तन महित्वं मध्या कर्तोर्विततं सं जभार |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat sūryasya devatvaṃ tan mahitvaṃ madhyā kartorvitataṃ saṃ jabhāra |
Translation: 4 This is the Godhead, this might of Sūrya: he hath withdrawn what spread o’er work unfinished.

Sanskit Text: यदेदयुक्त हरितः सधस्थादाद रात्री वासस्तनुते सिमस्मै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadedayukta haritaḥ sadhasthādād rātrī vāsastanute simasmai ||
Translation: When he hath loosed his Horses from their station, straight over all Night spreadeth out her garment.

Sanskit Text: तन मित्रस्य वरुणस्याभिचक्षे सूर्यो रूपं कर्णुते दयोरुपस्थे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan mitrasya varuṇasyābhicakṣe sūryo rūpaṃ kṛṇute dyorupasthe |
Translation: 5 In the sky's lap the Sun this form assumeth that Varuṇa and Mitra may behold it.

Sanskit Text: अनन्तमन्यद रुशदस्य पाजः कर्ष्णमन्यद धरितः सं भरन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anantamanyad ruśadasya pājaḥ kṛṣṇamanyad dharitaḥ saṃ bharanti ||
Translation: His Bay Steeds well maintain his power eternal, at one time bright and darksome at another.

Sanskit Text: अद्या देवा उदिता सूर्यस्य निरंहसः पिप्र्ता नरवद्यात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adyā devā uditā sūryasya niraṃhasaḥ pipṛtā naravadyāt |
Translation: 6 This day, O Gods, while Sūrya is ascending, deliver us from trouble and dishonour.

Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no ... ||
Translation: This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: मध्वः सोमस्याश्विना मदाय परत्नो होता विवासते वाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhvaḥ somasyāśvinā madāya pratno hotā vivāsate vām |
Translation: 1. AŚVINS, your ancient priest invites you hither to gladden you with draughts of meath of Soma.

Sanskit Text: बर्हिष्मती रातिर्विश्रिता गीरिषा यातं नासत्योप वाजैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: barhiṣmatī rātirviśritā ghīriṣā yātaṃ nāsatyopa vājaiḥ ||
Translation: Our gift is on the grass, our song apportioned: with food and strength come hither, O Nāsatyas.

Sanskit Text: यो वामश्विना मनसो जवीयान रथः सवश्वो विश आजिगाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vāmaśvinā manaso javīyān rathaḥ svaśvo viśa ājighāti |
Translation: 2 That car of yours, swifter than thought, O Aśvins, which drawn by brave steeds cometh to the people,

Sanskit Text: येन गछथः सुक्र्तो दुरोणं तेन नरा वर्तिरस्मभ्यं यातम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena ghachathaḥ sukṛto duroṇaṃ tena narā vartirasmabhyaṃ yātam ||
Translation: Whereon ye seek the dwelling of the pious,—come ye thereon to our abode, O Heroes.

Sanskit Text: रषिं नरावंहसः पाञ्चजन्यं रबीसादत्रिं मुञ्चथो गणेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṣiṃ narāvaṃhasaḥ pāñcajanyaṃ ṛbīsādatriṃ muñcatho ghaṇena |
Translation: 3 Ye freed sage Atri, whom the Five Tribes honoured, from the strait pit, ye Heroes with his people,

Sanskit Text: मिनन्ता दस्योरशिवस्य माया अनुपूर्वं वर्षणा चोदयन्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: minantā dasyoraśivasya māyā anupūrvaṃ vṛṣaṇā codayantā ||
Translation: Baffling the guiles of the malignant Dasyu, repelling them, ye Mighty in succession.

Sanskit Text: अश्वं न गूळ्हमश्विना दुरेवैर्र्षिं नरा वर्षणा रेभमप्सु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvaṃ na ghūḷhamaśvinā durevairṛṣiṃ narā vṛṣaṇā rebhamapsu |
Translation: 4 Rebha the sage, ye mighty Heroes, Aśvins! whom, like a horse, vile men had sunk in water,—

Sanskit Text: सं तं रिणीथो विप्रुतं दंसोभिर्न वां जूर्यन्ति पूर्व्या कर्तानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ taṃ riṇītho viprutaṃ daṃsobhirna vāṃ jūryanti pūrvyā kṛtāni ||
Translation: Him, wounded, with your wondrous power ye rescued: your exploits of old time endure for ever.

Sanskit Text: सुषुप्वांसं न निर्र्तेरुपस्थे सूर्यं न दस्रा तमसि कषियन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suṣupvāṃsaṃ na nirṛterupasthe sūryaṃ na dasrā tamasi kṣiyantam |
Translation: 5 Ye brought forth Vandana, ye Wonder-Workers, for triumph, like fair gold that hath been buried,

Sanskit Text: शुभे रुक्मं न दर्शतं निखातमुदूपथुरश्विना वन्दनाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śubhe rukmaṃ na darśataṃ nikhātamudūpathuraśvinā vandanāya ||
Translation: Like one who slumbered in destruction's bosom, or like the Sun when dwelling in the darkness.

Sanskit Text: तद वां नरा शंस्यं पज्रियेण कक्षीवता नासत्या परिज्मन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad vāṃ narā śaṃsyaṃ pajriyeṇa kakṣīvatā nāsatyā parijman |
Translation: 6 Kakṣīvān, Pajra's son, must laud that exploit of yours, Nāsatyas, Heroes, ye who wander!

Sanskit Text: शफादश्वस्य वाजिनो जनाय शतं कुम्भानसिञ्चतं मधूनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaphādaśvasya vājino janāya śataṃ kumbhānasiñcataṃ madhūnām ||
Translation: When from the hoof of your strong horse ye showered a hundred jars of honey for the people.

Sanskit Text: युवं नरा सतुवते कर्ष्णियाय विष्णाप्वं ददथुर्विश्वकाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ narā stuvate kṛṣṇiyāya viṣṇāpvaṃ dadathurviśvakāya |
Translation: 7 To Kṛṣṇa's son, to Viśvaka who praised you, O Heroes, ye restored his son Viṣṇāpū.

Sanskit Text: घोषायै चित पित्र्षदे दुरोने पतिं जूर्यन्त्या अश्विनावदत्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghoṣāyai cit pitṛṣade durone patiṃ jūryantyā aśvināvadattam ||
Translation: To Ghoṣā, living in her father's dwelling, stricken in years, ye gave a husband, Aśvins.

Sanskit Text: युवं शयावाय रुशतीमदत्तं महः कषोणस्याश्विना कण्वाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ śyāvāya ruśatīmadattaṃ mahaḥ kṣoṇasyāśvinā kaṇvāya |
Translation: 8 Ruṣatī, of the mighty people, Aśvins, ye gave to Śyāva of the line of Kaṇva.

Sanskit Text: परवाच्यं तद वर्षणा कर्तं वां यन नार्षदायश्रवो अध्यधत्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pravācyaṃ tad vṛṣaṇā kṛtaṃ vāṃ yan nārṣadāyaśravo adhyadhattam ||
Translation: This deed of yours, ye Strong Ones should be published, that ye gave glory to the son of Nṛṣad.

Sanskit Text: पुरू वर्पांस्यश्विना दधाना नि पेदव ऊहथुराशुमश्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purū varpāṃsyaśvinā dadhānā ni pedava ūhathurāśumaśvam |
Translation: 9 O Aśvins, wearing many forms at pleasure, on Pedu ye bestowed a fleet-foot courser,

Sanskit Text: सहस्रसां वाजिनमप्रतीतमहिहनं शरवस्यं तरुत्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasrasāṃ vājinamapratītamahihanaṃ śravasyaṃ tarutram ||
Translation: Strong, winner of a thousand spoils, resistless the serpent slayer, glorious, triumphant.

Sanskit Text: एतानि वां शरवस्या सुदानू बरह्माङगूषं सदनं रोदस्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etāni vāṃ śravasyā sudānū brahmāṅghūṣaṃ sadanaṃ rodasyoḥ |
Translation: 10 These glorious things are yours, ye Bounteous Givers; prayer, praise in both worlds are your habitation.

Sanskit Text: यद वां पज्रासो अश्विना हवन्ते यातमिषा च विदुषे च वाजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vāṃ pajrāso aśvinā havante yātamiṣā ca viduṣe ca vājam ||
Translation: O Aśvins, when the sons of Pajra call you, send strength with nourishment to him who knoweth.

Sanskit Text: सूनोर्मानेनाश्विना गर्णाना वाजं विप्राय भुरणा रदन्ता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūnormānenāśvinā ghṛṇānā vājaṃ viprāya bhuraṇā radantā |
Translation: 11 Hymned with the reverence of a son, O Aśvins ye Swift Ones giving booty to the singer,

Sanskit Text: अगस्त्ये बरह्मणा वाव्र्धाना सं विश्पलां नासत्यारिणीतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghastye brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānā saṃ viśpalāṃ nāsatyāriṇītam ||
Translation: Glorified by Agastya with devotion, established Viśpalā again, Nāsatyas.

Sanskit Text: कुह यान्ता सुष्टुतिं काव्यस्य दिवो नपाता वर्षणा शयुत्रा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kuha yāntā suṣṭutiṃ kāvyasya divo napātā vṛṣaṇā śayutrā |
Translation: 12 Ye Sons of Heaven, ye Mighty, whither went ye, sought ye, for his fair praise the home of Kāvya.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यस्येव कलशं निखातमुदूपथुर्दशमे अश्विनाहन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyasyeva kalaśaṃ nikhātamudūpathurdaśame aśvināhan ||
Translation: When, like a pitcher full of gold, O Aśvins, on the tenth day ye lifted up the buried?

Sanskit Text: युवं चयवानमश्विना जरन्तं पुनर्युवानं चक्रथुः शचीभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ cyavānamaśvinā jarantaṃ punaryuvānaṃ cakrathuḥ śacībhiḥ |
Translation: 13 Ye with the aid of your great powers, O Aśvins, restored to youth the ancient man Cyavāna.

Sanskit Text: युवो रथं दुहिता सूर्यस्य सह शरिया नासत्याव्र्णीत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvo rathaṃ duhitā sūryasya saha śriyā nāsatyāvṛṇīta ||
Translation: The Daughter of the Sun with all her glory, O ye Nāsatyas, chose your car to bear her.

Sanskit Text: युवं तुग्राय पूर्व्येभिरेवैः पुनर्मन्यावभवतं युवाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ tughrāya pūrvyebhirevaiḥ punarmanyāvabhavataṃ yuvānā |
Translation: 14 Ye, ever-youthful Ones, again remembered Tugra, according to your ancient manner:

Sanskit Text: युवं भुज्युमर्णसो निः समुद्राद विभिरूहथुर्र्ज्रेभिरश्वैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ bhujyumarṇaso niḥ samudrād vibhirūhathurṛjrebhiraśvaiḥ ||
Translation: With horses brown of hue that flew with swift wings ye brought back Bhujyu from the sea of billows.

Sanskit Text: अजोहवीदश्विना तौग्र्यो वां परोळ्हः समुद्रमव्यथिर्जगन्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajohavīdaśvinā taughryo vāṃ proḷhaḥ samudramavyathirjaghanvān |
Translation: 15 The son of Tugra had invoked you, Aśvins; borne on he went uninjured through the ocean.

Sanskit Text: निष टमूहथुः सुयुजा रथेन मनोजवसा वर्षणास्वस्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niṣ ṭamūhathuḥ suyujā rathena manojavasā vṛṣaṇāsvasti ||
Translation: Ye with your chariot swift as thought, well-harnessed, carried him off, O Mighty Ones, to safety.

Sanskit Text: अजोहवीदश्विना वर्तिका वामास्नो यत सीममुञ्चतं वर्कस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajohavīdaśvinā vartikā vāmāsno yat sīmamuñcataṃ vṛkasya |
Translation: 16 The quail had invocated you, O Aśvins, when from the wolf's devouring jaws ye freed her.

Sanskit Text: वि जयुषा ययथुः सान्वद्रेर्जातं विष्वाचो अहतं विषेण ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi jayuṣā yayathuḥ sānvadrerjātaṃ viṣvāco ahataṃ viṣeṇa ||
Translation: With conquering car ye cleft the mountain's ridges: the offspring of Viśvāc ye killed with poison.

Sanskit Text: शतं मेषान वर्क्ये मामहानं तमः परणीतमशिवेन पित्रा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ meṣān vṛkye māmahānaṃ tamaḥ praṇītamaśivena pitrā |
Translation: 17 He whom for furnishing a hundred wethers to the she-wolf, his wicked father blinded,—

Sanskit Text: आक्षी रज्राश्वे अश्विनावधत्तं जयोतिरन्धाय चक्रथुर्विचक्षे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ākṣī ṛjrāśve aśvināvadhattaṃ jyotirandhāya cakrathurvicakṣe ||
Translation: To him, Ṛjrāśva, gave ye eyes, O Aśvins; light to the blind ye sent for perfect vision.

Sanskit Text: शुनमन्धाय भरमह्वयत सा वर्कीरश्विना वर्षणा नरेति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śunamandhāya bharamahvayat sā vṛkīraśvinā vṛṣaṇā nareti |
Translation: 18 To bring the blind man joy thus cried the she-wolf: O Aśvins, O ye Mighty Ones, O Heroes,

Sanskit Text: जारः कनीन इव चक्षदान रज्राश्वः शतमेकंच मेषान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jāraḥ kanīna iva cakṣadāna ṛjrāśvaḥ śatamekaṃca meṣān ||
Translation: For me Ṛjrāśva, like a youthful lover, hath. cut piecemeal one and a hundred wethers.

Sanskit Text: मही वामूतिरश्विना मयोभूरुत सरामं धिष्ण्या संरिणीथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahī vāmūtiraśvinā mayobhūruta srāmaṃ dhiṣṇyā saṃriṇīthaḥ |
Translation: 19 Great and weal-giving is your aid, O Aśvins, ye, objects of all thought, made whole the cripple.

Sanskit Text: अथा युवामिदह्वयत पुरन्धिरागछतं सीं वर्षणाववोभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā yuvāmidahvayat purandhirāghachataṃ sīṃ vṛṣaṇāvavobhiḥ ||
Translation: Purandhi also for this cause invoked you, and ye, O mighty, came to her with succours.

Sanskit Text: अधेनुं दस्रा सतर्यं विषक्टामपिन्वतं शयवे अश्विनागाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhenuṃ dasrā staryaṃ viṣakṭāmapinvataṃ śayave aśvināghām |
Translation: 20 Ye, Wonder-Workers, filled with milk for Śayu the milkless cow, emaciated, barren;

Sanskit Text: युवं शचीभिर्विमदाय जायां नयूहथुः पुरुमित्रस्य योषाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ śacībhirvimadāya jāyāṃ nyūhathuḥ purumitrasya yoṣām ||
Translation: And by your powers the child of Purumitra ye brought to Vimada to be his consort.

Sanskit Text: यवं वर्केणाश्विना वपन्तेषं दुहन्ता मनुषाय दस्रा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yavaṃ vṛkeṇāśvinā vapanteṣaṃ duhantā manuṣāya dasrā |
Translation: 21 Ploughing and sowing barley, O ye Aśvins, milking out food for men, ye Wonder-Workers,

Sanskit Text: अभि दस्युं बकुरेणा धमन्तोरु जयोतिश्चक्रथुरार्याय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi dasyuṃ bakureṇā dhamantoru jyotiścakrathurāryāya ||
Translation: Blasting away the Dasyu with your trumpet, ye gave far-spreading light unto the Ārya.

Sanskit Text: आथर्वणायाश्विना दधीचे.अश्व्यं शिरः परत्यैरयतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ātharvaṇāyāśvinā dadhīce.aśvyaṃ śiraḥ pratyairayatam |
Translation: 22 Ye brought the horse's head, Aśvins, and gave it unto Dadhyac the offspring of Atharvan.

Sanskit Text: स वां मधु पर वोचद रतायन तवाष्ट्रं यद दस्रावपिकक्ष्यं वाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vāṃ madhu pra vocad ṛtāyan tvāṣṭraṃ yad dasrāvapikakṣyaṃ vām ||
Translation: True, he revealed to you, O Wonder-Workers, sweet Soma, Tvaṣṭar's secret, as your girdle.

Sanskit Text: सदा कवी सुमतिमा चके वां विश्वा धियो अश्विना परावतं मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadā kavī sumatimā cake vāṃ viśvā dhiyo aśvinā prāvataṃ me |
Translation: 23 O Sages, evermore I crave your favour: be gracious unto all my prayers, O Aśvins.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे रयिं नासत्या बर्हन्तमपत्यसाचं शरुत्यं रराथाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme rayiṃ nāsatyā bṛhantamapatyasācaṃ śrutyaṃ rarāthām ||
Translation: Grant me, Nāsatyas, riches in abundance, wealth famous and accompanied with children.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यहस्तमश्विना रराणा पुत्रं नरा वध्रिमत्या अदत्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyahastamaśvinā rarāṇā putraṃ narā vadhrimatyā adattam |
Translation: 24 With liberal bounty to the weakling's consorts ye, Heroes, gave a son Hiraṇyahasta;

Sanskit Text: तरिधा ह शयावमश्विना विकस्तमुज्जीवस ऐरयतंसुदानू ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tridhā ha śyāvamaśvinā vikastamujjīvasa airayataṃsudānū ||
Translation: And Śyāva, cut into three several pieces, ye brought to life again, O bounteous Aśvins.

Sanskit Text: एतानि वामश्विना वीर्याणि पर पूर्व्याण्यायवो.अवोचन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etāni vāmaśvinā vīryāṇi pra pūrvyāṇyāyavo.avocan |
Translation: 25 These your heroic exploits, O ye Aśvins, done in the days. of old, have men related.

Sanskit Text: बरह्मक्र्ण्वन्तो वर्षणा युवभ्यां सुवीरासो विदथमा वदेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmakṛṇvanto vṛṣaṇā yuvabhyāṃ suvīrāso vidathamā vadema ||
Translation: May we, addressing prayer to you, ye Mighty, speak with brave sons about us to the synod.

Sanskit Text: आ वां रथं पुरुमायं मनोजुवं जीराश्वं यज्ञियं जीवसे हुवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ rathaṃ purumāyaṃ manojuvaṃ jīrāśvaṃ yajñiyaṃ jīvase huve |
Translation: 1. HITHER, that I may live, I call unto the feast your wondrous car, thought-swift, borne on by rapid steeds.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रकेतुं वनिनं शतद्वसुं शरुष्टीवानं वरिवोधामभि परयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasraketuṃ vaninaṃ śatadvasuṃ śruṣṭīvānaṃ varivodhāmabhi prayaḥ ||
Translation: With thousand banners, hundred treasures, pouring gifts, promptly obedient, bestowing ample room.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वा धीतिः परत्यस्य परयामन्यधायि शस्मन समयन्त आ दिशः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvā dhītiḥ pratyasya prayāmanyadhāyi śasman samayanta ā diśaḥ |
Translation: 2 Even as it moveth near my hymn is lifted up, and all the regions come together to sing praise.

Sanskit Text: सवदामि घर्मं परति यन्त्यूतय आ वामूर्जानी रथमश्विनारुहत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svadāmi gharmaṃ prati yantyūtaya ā vāmūrjānī rathamaśvināruhat ||
Translation: I sweeten the oblations; now the helpers come. Ūrjānī hath, O Aśvins, mounted on your car.

Sanskit Text: सं यन मिथः पस्प्र्धानासो अग्मत शुभे मखा अमिता जायवो रणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yan mithaḥ paspṛdhānāso aghmata śubhe makhā amitā jāyavo raṇe |
Translation: 3 When striving man with man for glory they have met, brisk, measureless, eager for victory in fight,

Sanskit Text: युवोरह परवणे चेकिते रथो यदश्विना वहथः सूरिमा वरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvoraha pravaṇe cekite ratho yadaśvinā vahathaḥ sūrimā varam ||
Translation: Then verily your car is seen upon the slope when ye, O Aśvins, bring some choice boon to the prince.

Sanskit Text: युवं भुज्युं भुरमाणं विभिर्गतं सवयुक्तिभिर्निवहन्ता पित्र्भ्य आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ bhujyuṃ bhuramāṇaṃ vibhirghataṃ svayuktibhirnivahantā pitṛbhya ā |
Translation: 4 Ye came to Bhujyu while he struggled in the flood, with flying birds, self-yoked, ye bore him to his sires.

Sanskit Text: यासिष्टं वर्तिर्व्र्षणा विजेन्यं दिवोदासाय महि चेति वामवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāsiṣṭaṃ vartirvṛṣaṇā vijenyaṃ divodāsāya mahi ceti vāmavaḥ ||
Translation: Ye went to the far-distant home, O Mighty Ones; and famed is your great aid to Divodāsa given.

Sanskit Text: युवोरश्विना वपुषे युवायुजं रथं वाणी येमतुरस्य शर्ध्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvoraśvinā vapuṣe yuvāyujaṃ rathaṃ vāṇī yematurasya śardhyam |
Translation: 5 Aśvins, the car which you had yoked for glorious show your own two voices urged directed to its goal.

Sanskit Text: आ वां पतित्वं सख्याय जग्मुषी योषाव्र्णीतजेन्या युवां पती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ patitvaṃ sakhyāya jaghmuṣī yoṣāvṛṇītajenyā yuvāṃ patī ||
Translation: Then she who came for friendship, Maid of noble birth, elected you as Husbands, you to be her Lords.

Sanskit Text: युवं रेभं परिषूतेरुरुष्यथो हिमेन घर्मं परितप्तमत्रये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ rebhaṃ pariṣūteruruṣyatho himena gharmaṃ paritaptamatraye |
Translation: 6 Rebha ye saved from tyranny; for Atri's sake ye quenched with cold the fiery pit that compassed him.

Sanskit Text: युवं शयोरवसं पिप्यथुर्गवि पर दीर्घेण वन्दनस्तार्यायुषा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ śayoravasaṃ pipyathurghavi pra dīrgheṇa vandanastāryāyuṣā ||
Translation: Ye made the cow of Śayu stream refreshing milk, and Vandana was holpen to extended life.

Sanskit Text: युवं वन्दनं निर्र्तं जरण्यया रथं न दस्रा करणा समिन्वथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ vandanaṃ nirṛtaṃ jaraṇyayā rathaṃ na dasrā karaṇā saminvathaḥ |
Translation: 7 Doers of marvels, skilful workers, ye restored Vandana, like a car, worn out with length of days.

Sanskit Text: कषेत्रादा विप्रं जनथो विपन्यया पर वामत्र विधते दंसना भुवत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣetrādā vipraṃ janatho vipanyayā pra vāmatra vidhate daṃsanā bhuvat ||
Translation: From earth ye brought the sage to life in wondrous mode; be your great deeds done here for him who honours you.

Sanskit Text: अगछतं कर्पमाणं परावति पितुः सवस्य तयजसा निबाधितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghachataṃ kṛpamāṇaṃ parāvati pituḥ svasya tyajasā nibādhitam |
Translation: 8 Ye went to him who mourned in a far distant place, him who was left forlorn by treachery of his sire.

Sanskit Text: सवर्वतीरित ऊतीर्युवोरह चित्रा अभीके अभवन्नभिष्टयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svarvatīrita ūtīryuvoraha citrā abhīke abhavannabhiṣṭayaḥ ||
Translation: Rich with the light of heaven was then the help ye gave, and marvellous your succour when ye stood by him.

Sanskit Text: उत सया वां मधुमन मक्षिकारपन मदे सोमस्यौशिजो हुवन्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta syā vāṃ madhuman makṣikārapan made somasyauśijo huvanyati |
Translation: 9 To you in praise of sweetness sang the honey-bee: Auśija calleth you in Soma's rapturous joy.

Sanskit Text: युवं दधीचो मन आ विवासथो.अथा शिरः परति वामश्व्यं वदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ dadhīco mana ā vivāsatho.athā śiraḥ prati vāmaśvyaṃ vadat ||
Translation: Ye drew unto yourselves the spirit of Dadhyac, and then the horse's head uttered his words to you.

Sanskit Text: युवं पेदवे पुरुवारमश्विना सप्र्धां शवेतं तरुतारन्दुवस्यथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ pedave puruvāramaśvinā spṛdhāṃ śvetaṃ tarutāranduvasyathaḥ |
Translation: 10 A horse did ye provide for Pedu, excellent, white, O ye Aśvins, conqueror of combatants,

Sanskit Text: शर्यैरभिद्युं पर्तनासु दुष्टरं चर्क्र्त्यमिन्द्रमिव चर्षणीसहम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaryairabhidyuṃ pṛtanāsu duṣṭaraṃ carkṛtyamindramiva carṣaṇīsaham ||
Translation: Invincible in war by arrows, seeking heaven worthy of fame, like Indra, vanquisher of men.

Sanskit Text: का राधद धोत्राश्विना वां को वां जोष उभयोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kā rādhad dhotrāśvinā vāṃ ko vāṃ joṣa ubhayoḥ |
Translation: 1. AŚVINS, what praise may win your grace? Who may be pleasing to you both?

Sanskit Text: कथा विधात्यप्रचेताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kathā vidhātyapracetāḥ ||
Translation: How shall the ignorant worship you?

Sanskit Text: विद्वांसाविद दुरः पर्छेदविद्वानित्थापरो अचेताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidvāṃsāvid duraḥ pṛchedavidvānitthāparo acetāḥ |
Translation: 2 Here let the ignorant ask the means of you who know—for none beside you knoweth aught—

Sanskit Text: नू चिन नु मर्ते अक्रौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū cin nu marte akrau ||
Translation: Not of a spiritless mortal man.

Sanskit Text: ता विद्वांसा हवामहे वां ता नो विद्वांसा मन्म वोचेतमद्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā vidvāṃsā havāmahe vāṃ tā no vidvāṃsā manma vocetamadya |
Translation: 3 Such as ye: are, all-wise, we call you. Ye wise, declare to us this day accepted prayer.

Sanskit Text: परार्चद दयमानो युवाकुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prārcad dayamāno yuvākuḥ ||
Translation: Loving you well your servant lauds you.

Sanskit Text: वि पर्छामि पाक्या न देवान वषट्क्र्तस्याद्भुतस्य दस्रा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi pṛchāmi pākyā na devān vaṣaṭkṛtasyādbhutasya dasrā |
Translation: 4 Simply, ye Mighty Ones, I ask the Gods of that wondrous oblation hallowed by the mystic word.

Sanskit Text: पातं च सह्यसो युवं च रभ्यसो नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pātaṃ ca sahyaso yuvaṃ ca rabhyaso naḥ ||
Translation: Save us from what is stronger, fiercer than ourselves.

Sanskit Text: पर या घोषे भर्गवाणे न शोभे यया वाचा यजति पज्रियो वाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yā ghoṣe bhṛghavāṇe na śobhe yayā vācā yajati pajriyo vām |
Translation: 5 Forth go the hymn that shone in Ghoṣā Bhṛgu's like, the song wherewith the son of Pajra worships you,

Sanskit Text: परैषयुर्न विद्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: praiṣayurna vidvān ||
Translation: Like some wise minister.

Sanskit Text: शरुतं गायत्रं तकवानस्याहं चिद धि रिरेभाश्विना वाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrutaṃ ghāyatraṃ takavānasyāhaṃ cid dhi rirebhāśvinā vām |
Translation: 6 Hear ye the song of him who hastens speedily. O Aśvins, I am he who sang your praise.

Sanskit Text: आक्षी शुभस पती दन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ākṣī śubhas patī dan ||
Translation: Hither, ye Lords of Splendour, hither turn your eyes.

Sanskit Text: युवं हयास्तं महो रन युवं वा यन निरततंसतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ hyāstaṃ maho ran yuvaṃ vā yan niratataṃsatam |
Translation: 7 For ye were ever nigh to deal forth ample wealth, to give the wealth that ye had gathered up.

Sanskit Text: तानो वसू सुगोपा सयातं पातं नो वर्कादघायोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāno vasū sughopā syātaṃ pātaṃ no vṛkādaghāyoḥ ||
Translation: As such, ye Vasus, guard us well, and keep us safely from the wicked wolf.

Sanskit Text: मा कस्मै धातमभ्यमित्रिणे नो माकुत्रा नो गर्हेभ्यो धेनवो गुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā kasmai dhātamabhyamitriṇe no mākutrā no ghṛhebhyo dhenavo ghuḥ |
Translation: 8 Give us not up to any man who hateth us, nor let our milch-cows stray, whose udders give us food,

Sanskit Text: सतनाभुजो अशिश्वीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stanābhujo aśiśvīḥ ||
Translation: Far from our homes without their calves.

Sanskit Text: दुहीयन मित्रधितये युवाकु राये च नो मिमीतं वाजवत्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: duhīyan mitradhitaye yuvāku rāye ca no mimītaṃ vājavatyai |
Translation: 9 May they who love you gain you for their Friends. Prepare ye us for opulence with strengthening food,

Sanskit Text: इषे च नो मिमीतं धेनुमत्यै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣe ca no mimītaṃ dhenumatyai ||
Translation: Prepare us for the food that floweth from our cows

Sanskit Text: अश्विनोरसनं रथमनश्वं वाजिनावतोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvinorasanaṃ rathamanaśvaṃ vājināvatoḥ |
Translation: 10 I have obtained the horseless car of Aśvins rich in sacrifice,

Sanskit Text: तेनाहं भूरि चाकन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tenāhaṃ bhūri cākana ||
Translation: And I am well content therewith.

Sanskit Text: अयं समह मा तनूह्याते जनाननु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ samaha mā tanūhyāte janānanu |
Translation: 11 May it convey me evermore: may the light chariot pass from men

Sanskit Text: सोमपेयं सुखो रथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somapeyaṃ sukho rathaḥ ||
Translation: To men unto the Soma draught.

Sanskit Text: अध सवप्नस्य निर्विदे.अभुञ्जतश्च रेवतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha svapnasya nirvide.abhuñjataśca revataḥ |
Translation: 12 It holdeth slumber in contempt. and the rich who enjoyeth not:

Sanskit Text: उभा ता बस्रि नश्यतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhā tā basri naśyataḥ ||
Translation: Both vanish quickly and are lost.

Sanskit Text: पर वः पान्तं रघुमन्यवो.अन्धो यज्ञं रुद्राय मीळ्हुषे भरद्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vaḥ pāntaṃ raghumanyavo.andho yajñaṃ rudrāya mīḷhuṣe bharadvam |
Translation: 1. SAY, bringing sacrifice to bounteous Rudra, This juice for drink to you whose wrath is fleeting!

Sanskit Text: दिवो अस्तोष्यसुरस्य वीरैरिषुध्येव मरुतो रोदस्योः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo astoṣyasurasya vīrairiṣudhyeva maruto rodasyoḥ ||
Translation: With Dyaus the Asura's Heroes I have lauded the Maruts as with prayer to Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: पत्नीव पूर्वहूतिं वाव्र्धध्या उषासानक्ता पुरुधा विदाने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: patnīva pūrvahūtiṃ vāvṛdhadhyā uṣāsānaktā purudhā vidāne |
Translation: 2 Strong to exalt the early invocation are Night and Dawn who show with varied aspect.

Sanskit Text: सतरीर नात्कं वयुतं वसाना सूर्यस्य शरिया सुद्र्शी हिरण्यैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: starīr nātkaṃ vyutaṃ vasānā sūryasya śriyā sudṛśī hiraṇyaiḥ ||
Translation: The Barren clothes her in wide-woven raiment, and fair Morn shines with Sūrya's golden splendour.

Sanskit Text: ममत्तु नः परिज्मा वसर्हा ममत्तु वातो अपां वर्षण्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mamattu naḥ parijmā vasarhā mamattu vāto apāṃ vṛṣaṇvān |
Translation: 3 Cheer us the Roamer round, who strikes at morning, the Wind delight us, pourer forth of waters!

Sanskit Text: शिशीतमिन्द्रापर्वता युवं नस्तन नो विश्वे वरिवस्यन्तुदेवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śiśītamindrāparvatā yuvaṃ nastan no viśve varivasyantudevāḥ ||
Translation: Sharpen our wits, O Parvata and Indra. May all the Gods vouchsafe to us this favour.

Sanskit Text: उत तया मे यशसा शवेतनायै वयन्ता पान्तौशिजो हुवध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tyā me yaśasā śvetanāyai vyantā pāntauśijo huvadhyai |
Translation: 4 And Auśija shall call for me that famous Pair who enjoy and drink, who come to brighten.

Sanskit Text: पर वो नपातमपां कर्णुध्वं पर मातरा रास्पिनस्यायोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vo napātamapāṃ kṛṇudhvaṃ pra mātarā rāspinasyāyoḥ ||
Translation: Set ye the Offspring of the Floods before you; both Mothers of the Living One who beameth.

Sanskit Text: आ वो रुवण्युमौशिजो हुवध्यै घोषेव शंसमर्जुनस्य नंशे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vo ruvaṇyumauśijo huvadhyai ghoṣeva śaṃsamarjunasya naṃśe |
Translation: 5 For you shall Auśija call him who thunders, as, to win Arjuna's assent, cried Ghoṣā.

Sanskit Text: पर वः पूष्णे दावन आनछा वोचेय वसुतातिमग्नेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vaḥ pūṣṇe dāvana ānachā voceya vasutātimaghneḥ ||
Translation: I will invoke, that Pūṣan may be bounteous to you, the rich munificence of Agni.

Sanskit Text: शरुतं मे मित्रावरुणा हवेमोत शरुतं सदने विश्वतः सीम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrutaṃ me mitrāvaruṇā havemota śrutaṃ sadane viśvataḥ sīm |
Translation: 6 Hear, Mitra-Varuṇa, these mine invocations, hear them from all men in the hall of worship.

Sanskit Text: शरोतु नः शरोतुरातिः सुश्रोतुः सुक्षेत्रा सिन्धुरद्भिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrotu naḥ śroturātiḥ suśrotuḥ sukṣetrā sindhuradbhiḥ ||
Translation: Giver of famous gifts, kind hearer, Sindhu who gives fair fields, listen with all his waters!

Sanskit Text: सतुषे सा वां वरुण मित्र रातिर्गवां शता पर्क्षयामेषु पज्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stuṣe sā vāṃ varuṇa mitra rātirghavāṃ śatā pṛkṣayāmeṣu pajre |
Translation: 7 Praised, Mitra, Varuṇa! is your gift, a hundred cows to the Pṛkṣayāmas and the Pajra.

Sanskit Text: शरुतरथे परियरथे दधानाः सद्यः पुष्टिंनिरुन्धानासो अग्मन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrutarathe priyarathe dadhānāḥ sadyaḥ puṣṭiṃnirundhānāso aghman ||
Translation: Presented by car-famous Priyaratha, supplying nourishment, they came directly.

Sanskit Text: अस्य सतुषे महिमघस्य राधः सचा सनेम नहुषः सुवीराः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya stuṣe mahimaghasya rādhaḥ sacā sanema nahuṣaḥ suvīrāḥ |
Translation: 8 Praised is the gift of him the very wealthy: may we enjoy it, men with hero children:

Sanskit Text: जनो यः पज्रेभ्यो वाजिनीवानश्वावतो रथिनो मह्यं सूरिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jano yaḥ pajrebhyo vājinīvānaśvāvato rathino mahyaṃ sūriḥ ||
Translation: His who hath many gifts to give the Pajras, a chief who makes me rich in cars and horses.

Sanskit Text: जनो यो मित्रावरुणावभिध्रुगपो न वां सुनोत्यक्ष्णयाध्रुक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jano yo mitrāvaruṇāvabhidhrughapo na vāṃ sunotyakṣṇayādhruk |
Translation: 9 The folk, O Mitra-Varuṇa, who hate you, who sinfully hating pour you no libations,

Sanskit Text: सवयं स यक्ष्मं हर्दये नि धत्त आप यदीं होत्राभिर्र्तावा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svayaṃ sa yakṣmaṃ hṛdaye ni dhatta āpa yadīṃ hotrābhirṛtāvā ||
Translation: Lay in their hearts, themselves, a wasting sickness, whereas the righteous gaineth all by worship.

Sanskit Text: स वराधतो नहुषो दंसुजूतः शर्धस्तरो नरां गूर्तश्रवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vrādhato nahuṣo daṃsujūtaḥ śardhastaro narāṃ ghūrtaśravāḥ |
Translation: 10 That man, most puissant, wondrously urged onward, famed among heroes, liberal in giving,

Sanskit Text: विस्र्ष्टरातिर्याति बाळ्हस्र्त्वा विश्वासु पर्त्सु सदमिच्छूरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: visṛṣṭarātiryāti bāḷhasṛtvā viśvāsu pṛtsu sadamicchūraḥ ||
Translation: Moveth a warrior, evermore undaunted in all encounters even with the mighty.

Sanskit Text: अध गमन्ता नहुषो हवं सूरेः शरोता राजानो अम्र्तस्य मन्द्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha ghmantā nahuṣo havaṃ sūreḥ śrotā rājāno amṛtasya mandrāḥ |
Translation: 11 Come to the man's, the sacrificer's calling: hear, Kings of Immortality, joy-givers!

Sanskit Text: नभोजुवो यन निरवस्य राधः परशस्तये महिनारथवते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nabhojuvo yan niravasya rādhaḥ praśastaye mahinārathavate ||
Translation: While ye who speed through clouds decree your bounty largely, for fame, to him the chariot rider.

Sanskit Text: एतं शर्धं धाम यस्य सूरेरित्यवोचन दशतयस्य नंशे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etaṃ śardhaṃ dhāma yasya sūrerityavocan daśatayasya naṃśe |
Translation: 12 Vigour will we bestow on that adorer whose tenfold draught we come to taste, so spake they.

Sanskit Text: दयुम्नानि येषु वसुताती रारन विश्वे सन्वन्तु परभ्र्थेषु वाजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyumnāni yeṣu vasutātī rāran viśve sanvantu prabhṛtheṣu vājam ||
Translation: May all in whom rest splendour and great riches obtain refreshment in these sacrifices.

Sanskit Text: मन्दामहे दशतयस्य धासेर्द्विर्यत पञ्च बिभ्रतो यन्त्यन्ना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mandāmahe daśatayasya dhāserdviryat pañca bibhrato yantyannā |
Translation: 13 We will rejoice to drink the tenfold present when the twicefive come bearing sacred viands.

Sanskit Text: किमिष्टाश्व इष्टरश्मिरेत ईशानासस्तरुषर्ञ्जते नॄन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kimiṣṭāśva iṣṭaraśmireta īśānāsastaruṣaṛñjate nṝn ||
Translation: What can he do whose steeds and reins are choicest? These, the all-potent, urge brave men to conquest.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यकर्णं मणिग्रीवमर्णस्तन नो विश्वे वरिवस्यन्तु देवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyakarṇaṃ maṇighrīvamarṇastan no viśve varivasyantu devāḥ |
Translation: 14 The sea and all the Deities shall give us him with the golden ear and neck bejewelled.

Sanskit Text: अर्यो गिरः सद्य आ जग्मुषीरोस्राश्चाकन्तूभयेष्वस्मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aryo ghiraḥ sadya ā jaghmuṣīrosrāścākantūbhayeṣvasme ||
Translation: Dawns, hasting to the praises of the pious, be pleased with us, both offerers and singers.

Sanskit Text: चत्वारो मा मशर्शारस्य शिश्वस्त्रयो राज्ञ आयवसस्यजिष्णोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: catvāro mā maśarśārasya śiśvastrayo rājña āyavasasyajiṣṇoḥ |
Translation: 15 Four youthful sons of Maśarśāra vex me, three, of the king, the conquering Ayavasa.

Sanskit Text: रथो वां मित्रावरुणा दीर्घा]पसाः सयूमगभस्तिः सूरो नाद्यौत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ratho vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā dīrghā]psāḥ syūmaghabhastiḥ sūro nādyaut ||
Translation: Now like the Sun, O Varuṇa and Mitra, your car hath shone, long-shaped and reined with splendour.

Sanskit Text: पर्थू रथो दक्षिणाया अयोज्यैनं देवासो अम्र्तासो अस्थुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛthū ratho dakṣiṇāyā ayojyainaṃ devāso amṛtāso asthuḥ |
Translation: 1. THE Dakṣiṇā's broad chariot hath been harnessed: this car the Gods Immortal have ascended.

Sanskit Text: कर्ष्णादुदस्थादर्या विहायाश्चिकित्सन्ती मानुषायक्षयाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṣṇādudasthādaryā vihāyāścikitsantī mānuṣāyakṣayāya ||
Translation: Fain to bring light to homes of men the noble and active Goddess hath emerged from darkness.

Sanskit Text: पूर्वा विश्वस्माद भुवनादबोधि जयन्ती वाजं बर्हती सनुत्री |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvā viśvasmād bhuvanādabodhi jayantī vājaṃ bṛhatī sanutrī |
Translation: 2 She before all the living world hath wakened, the Lofty One who wins and gathers treasure.

Sanskit Text: उच्चा वयख्यद युवतिः पुनर्भूरोषा अगन परथमा पूर्वहूतौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uccā vyakhyad yuvatiḥ punarbhūroṣā aghan prathamā pūrvahūtau ||
Translation: Revived and ever young on high she glances. Dawn hath come first unto our morning worship.

Sanskit Text: यदद्य भागं विभजासि नर्भ्य उषो देवि मर्त्यत्रा सुजाते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadadya bhāghaṃ vibhajāsi nṛbhya uṣo devi martyatrā sujāte |
Translation: 3 If, Dawn, thou Goddess nobly born, thou dealest fortune this day to all the race of mortals,

Sanskit Text: देवो नो अत्र सविता दमूना अनागसो वोचति सूर्याय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devo no atra savitā damūnā anāghaso vocati sūryāya ||
Translation: May Savitar the God, Friend of the homestead, declare before the Sun that we are sinless.

Sanskit Text: गर्हं-गर्हमहना यात्यछा दिवे-दिवे अधि नामा दधाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛhaṃ-ghṛhamahanā yātyachā dive-dive adhi nāmā dadhānā |
Translation: 4 Showing her wonted form each day that passeth, spreading the light she visiteth each dwelling.

Sanskit Text: सिषासन्ती दयोतना शश्वदागादग्रम-अग्रमिद भजतेवसूनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: siṣāsantī dyotanā śaśvadāghādaghram-aghramid bhajatevasūnām ||
Translation: Eager for conquest, with bright sheen she cometh. Her portion is the best of goodly treasures.

Sanskit Text: भगस्य सवसा वरुणस्य जामिरुषः सून्र्ते परथमा जरस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhaghasya svasā varuṇasya jāmiruṣaḥ sūnṛte prathamā jarasva |
Translation: 5 Sister of Varuṇa, sister of Bhaga, first among all sing forth, O joyous Morning.

Sanskit Text: पश्चा स दघ्या यो अघस्य धाता जयेम तं दक्षिणया रथेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: paścā sa daghyā yo aghasya dhātā jayema taṃ dakṣiṇayā rathena ||
Translation: Weak be the strength of him who worketh evil: may we subdue him with our car the guerdon.

Sanskit Text: उदीरतां सून्र्ता उत पुरन्धीरुदग्नयः शुशुचानासोस्थुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udīratāṃ sūnṛtā ut purandhīrudaghnayaḥ śuśucānāsoasthuḥ |
Translation: 6 Let our glad hymns and holy thoughts rise upward, for the flames brightly burning have ascended.

Sanskit Text: सपार्हा वसूनि तमसापगूळ्हाविष कर्ण्वन्त्युषसो विभातीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: spārhā vasūni tamasāpaghūḷhāviṣ kṛṇvantyuṣaso vibhātīḥ ||
Translation: The far-refulgent Mornings make apparent the lovely treasures which the darkness covered.

Sanskit Text: अपान्यदेत्यभ्यन्यदेति विषुरूपे अहनी सं चरेते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apānyadetyabhyanyadeti viṣurūpe ahanī saṃ carete |
Translation: 7 The one departeth and the other cometh: unlike in hue day's, halves march on successive.

Sanskit Text: परिक्षितोस्तमो अन्या गुहाकरद्यौदुषाः शोशुचता रथेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parikṣitostamo anyā ghuhākaradyauduṣāḥ śośucatā rathena ||
Translation: One hides the gloom of the surrounding Parents. Dawn on her shining chariot is resplendent.

Sanskit Text: सद्र्शीरद्य सद्र्शीरिदु शवो दीर्घं सचन्ते वरुणस्यधाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadṛśīradya sadṛśīridu śvo dīrghaṃ sacante varuṇasyadhāma |
Translation: 8 The same in form to-day, the same tomorrow, they still keep Varuṇa's eternal statute.

Sanskit Text: अनवद्यास्त्रिंशतं योजनान्येकैका करतुं परियन्ति सद्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anavadyāstriṃśataṃ yojanānyekaikā kratuṃ pariyanti sadyaḥ ||
Translation: Blameless, in turn they traverse thirty regions, and dart across the spirit in a moment.

Sanskit Text: जानत्यह्नः परथमस्य नाम शुक्रा कर्ष्णादजनिष्ट शवितीची |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jānatyahnaḥ prathamasya nāma śukrā kṛṣṇādajaniṣṭa śvitīcī |
Translation: 9 She who hath knowledge Of the first day's nature is born refulgent white from out the darkness.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य योषा न मिनाति धामाहर अहर्निष्क्र्तमाचरन्ती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya yoṣā na mināti dhāmāhar aharniṣkṛtamācarantī ||
Translation: The Maiden breaketh not the law of Order, day by day coming to the place appointed.

Sanskit Text: कन्येव तन्वा शाशदानानेषि देवि देवमियक्षमाणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kanyeva tanvā śāśadānāneṣi devi devamiyakṣamāṇam |
Translation: 10 In pride of beauty like a maid thou goest, O Goddess, to the God who longs to win thee,

Sanskit Text: संस्मयमाना युवतिः पुरस्तादाविर्वक्षांसि कर्णुषे विभाती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃsmayamānā yuvatiḥ purastādāvirvakṣāṃsi kṛṇuṣe vibhātī ||
Translation: And smiling youthful, as thou shinest brightly, before him thou discoverest thy bosom.

Sanskit Text: सुसंकाशा मात्र्म्र्ष्टेव योषाविस्तन्वं कर्णुषे दर्शे कम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: susaṃkāśā mātṛmṛṣṭeva yoṣāvistanvaṃ kṛṇuṣe dṛśe kam |
Translation: 11 Fair as a bride embellished by her mother thou showest forth thy form that all may see it.

Sanskit Text: भद्रा तवमुषो वितरं वयुछ न तत ते अन्या उषसोनशन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadrā tvamuṣo vitaraṃ vyucha na tat te anyā uṣasonaśanta ||
Translation: Blessed art thou O Dawn. Shine yet more widely. No other Dawns have reached what thou attainest.

Sanskit Text: अश्वावतीर्गोमतीर्विश्ववारा यतमाना रश्मिभिः सूर्यस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvāvatīrghomatīrviśvavārā yatamānā raśmibhiḥ sūryasya |
Translation: 12 Rich in kine, horses, and all goodly treasures, in constant operation with the sunbeams,

Sanskit Text: परा च यन्ति पुनरा च यन्ति भद्रा नाम वहमानाुषासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parā ca yanti punarā ca yanti bhadrā nāma vahamānāuṣāsaḥ ||
Translation: The Dawns depart and come again assuming their wonted forms that promise happy fortune.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य रश्मिमनुयछमाना भद्रम-भद्रं करतुमस्मासु धेहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya raśmimanuyachamānā bhadram-bhadraṃ kratumasmāsu dhehi |
Translation: 13 Obedient to the rein of Law Eternal give us each thought that more and more shall bless us.

Sanskit Text: उषो नो अद्य सुहवा वयुछास्मासु रायो मघवत्सु च सयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣo no adya suhavā vyuchāsmāsu rāyo maghavatsu ca syuḥ ||
Translation: Shine thou on us to-day, Dawn, swift to listen. With us be riches and with chiefs who worship.

Sanskit Text: पराता रत्नं परातरित्वा दधाति तं चिकित्वान परतिग्र्ह्यानि धत्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātā ratnaṃ prātaritvā dadhāti taṃ cikitvān pratighṛhyāni dhatte |
Translation: 1. COMING at early morn he gives his treasure; the prudent one receives and entertains him.

Sanskit Text: तेन परजां वर्धयमान आयू रायस पोषेण सचते सुवीरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tena prajāṃ vardhayamāna āyū rāyas poṣeṇa sacate suvīraḥ ||
Translation: Thereby increasing still his life and offspring, he comes with brave sons to abundant riches.

Sanskit Text: सुगुरसत सुहिरण्यः सवश्वो बर्हदस्मै वय इन्द्रो दधाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sughurasat suhiraṇyaḥ svaśvo bṛhadasmai vaya indro dadhāti |
Translation: 2 Rich shall he be in gold and kine and horses. Indra bestows on him great vital power,

Sanskit Text: यस्त्वायन्तं वसुना परातरित्वो मुक्षीजयेव पदिमुत्सिनाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yastvāyantaṃ vasunā prātaritvo mukṣījayeva padimutsināti ||
Translation: Who stays thee, as thou comest, with his treasure, like game caught in the net, O early comer.

Sanskit Text: आयमद्य सुक्र्तं परातरिछन्निष्टेः पुत्रं वसुमता रथेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āyamadya sukṛtaṃ prātarichanniṣṭeḥ putraṃ vasumatā rathena |
Translation: 3 Longing, I came this morning to the pious, the son of sacrifice, with car wealth-laden.

Sanskit Text: अंशोः सुतं पायय मत्सरस्य कषयद्वीरं वर्धय सून्र्ताभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṃśoḥ sutaṃ pāyaya matsarasya kṣayadvīraṃ vardhaya sūnṛtābhiḥ ||
Translation: Give him to drink juice of the stalk that gladdens; prosper with pleasant hymns the Lord of Heroes.

Sanskit Text: उप कषरन्ति सिन्धवो मयोभुव ईजानं च यक्ष्यमाणं चधेनवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa kṣaranti sindhavo mayobhuva ījānaṃ ca yakṣyamāṇaṃ cadhenavaḥ |
Translation: 4 Health-bringing streams, as milch-cows, flow to profit him who hath worshipped, him who now will worship.

Sanskit Text: पर्णन्तं च पपुरिं च शरवस्यवो घर्तस्य धारा उप यन्ति विश्वतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛṇantaṃ ca papuriṃ ca śravasyavo ghṛtasya dhārā upa yanti viśvataḥ ||
Translation: To him who freely gives and fills on all sides full streams of fatness flow and make him famous.

Sanskit Text: नाकस्य पर्ष्ठे अधि तिष्ठति शरितो यः पर्णाति स ह देवेषु गछति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nākasya pṛṣṭhe adhi tiṣṭhati śrito yaḥ pṛṇāti sa ha deveṣu ghachati |
Translation: 5 On the high ridge of heaven he stands exalted, yea, to the Gods he goes, the liberal giver.

Sanskit Text: तस्मा आपो घर्तमर्षन्ति सिन्धवस्तस्मा इयं दक्षिणा पिन्वते सदा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmā āpo ghṛtamarṣanti sindhavastasmā iyaṃ dakṣiṇā pinvate sadā ||
Translation: The streams, the waters flow for him with fatness: to him this guerdon ever yields abundance.

Sanskit Text: दक्षिणावतामिदिमानि चित्रा दक्षिणावतां दिवि सूर्यासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dakṣiṇāvatāmidimāni citrā dakṣiṇāvatāṃ divi sūryāsaḥ |
Translation: 6 For those who give rich meeds are all these splendours, for those who give rich meeds suns shine in heaven.

Sanskit Text: दक्षिणावन्तो अम्र्तं भजन्ते दक्षिणावन्तः पर तिरन्त आयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dakṣiṇāvanto amṛtaṃ bhajante dakṣiṇāvantaḥ pra tiranta āyuḥ ||
Translation: The givers of rich meeds are made immortal; the givers of rich fees prolong their lifetime.

Sanskit Text: मा पर्णन्तो दुरितमेन आरन मा जारिषुः सूरयः सुव्रतासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā pṛṇanto duritamena āran mā jāriṣuḥ sūrayaḥ suvratāsaḥ |
Translation: 7 Let not the liberal sink to sin and sorrow, never decay the pious chiefs who worship!

Sanskit Text: अन्यस्तेषां परिधिरस्तु कश्चिदप्र्णन्तमभि सं यन्तु शोकाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anyasteṣāṃ paridhirastu kaścidapṛṇantamabhi saṃ yantu śokāḥ ||
Translation: Let every man besides be their protection, and let affliction fall upon the niggard.

Sanskit Text: पर-पर पूष्णस तुविजातस्य शस्यते महित्वम अस्य तवसो न तन्दते सतोत्रम अस्य न तन्दते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra-pra pūṣṇas tuvijātasya śasyate mahitvam asya tavaso na tandate stotram asya na tandate |
Translation: 1. STRONG Pūṣan's majesty is lauded evermore, the glory of his lordly might is never faint, his song of praise is never faint.

Sanskit Text: अर्चामि सुम्नयन्न अहम अन्त्यूतिम मयोभुवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arcāmi sumnayann aham antyūtim mayobhuvam |
Translation: Seeking felicity I laud him nigh to help, the source, of bliss,

Sanskit Text: विश्वस्य यो मन आयुयुवे मखो देव आयुयुवे मखः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvasya yo mana āyuyuve makho deva āyuyuve makhaḥ ||
Translation: Who, Vigorous one, hath drawn to him the hearts of all, drawn them, the Vigorous One, the God.
