Sanskit Text: पर हि तवा पूषन्न अजिरं न यामनि सतोमेभिः कर्ण्व रणवो यथा मर्ध उष्ट्रो न पीपरो मर्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra hi tvā pūṣann ajiraṃ na yāmani stomebhiḥ kṛṇva ṛṇavo yathā mṛdha uṣṭro na pīparo mṛdhaḥ |
Translation: 2 Thee, then, O Pūṣan, like a swift one on his way, I urge with lauds that thou mayst make the foemen flee, drive, camel-like, our foes afar.

Sanskit Text: हुवे यत तवा मयोभुवं देवं सख्याय मर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: huve yat tvā mayobhuvaṃ devaṃ sakhyāya martyaḥ |
Translation: As I, a man, call thee, a God, giver of bliss, to be my Friend,

Sanskit Text: अस्माकम आङगूषान दयुम्निनस कर्धि वाजेषु दयुम्निनस कर्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākam āṅghūṣān dyumninas kṛdhi vājeṣu dyumninas kṛdhi ||
Translation: So make our loudly-chanted praises glorious, in battles make them glorious.

Sanskit Text: यस्य ते पूषन सख्ये विपन्यवः करत्वा चित सन्तो ऽवसा बुभुज्रिर इति करत्वा बुभुज्रिरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya te pūṣan sakhye vipanyavaḥ kratvā cit santo 'vasā bubhujrira iti kratvā bubhujrire |
Translation: 3 Thou, Pūṣan, in whose friendship they who sing forth praise enjoy advantage, even in wisdom, through thy grace, in wisdom even they are advanced.

Sanskit Text: ताम अनु तवा नवीयसीं नियुतं राय ईमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tām anu tvā navīyasīṃ niyutaṃ rāya īmahe |
Translation: So, after this most recent course, we come to thee with prayers for wealth.

Sanskit Text: अहेळमान उरुशंस सरी भव वाजे-वाजे सरी भव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aheḷamāna uruśaṃsa sarī bhava vāje-vāje sarī bhava ||
Translation: Not stirred to anger, O Wide-Ruler, come to us, come thou to us in every fight.

Sanskit Text: अस्या ऊ षु ण उप सातये भुवो ऽहेळमानो ररिवां अजाश्व शरवस्यताम अजाश्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asyā ū ṣu ṇa upa sātaye bhuvo 'heḷamāno rarivāṃ ajāśva śravasyatām ajāśva |
Translation: 4 Not stirred to anger, come, Free-giver, nigh to us, to take this gift of ours, thou who hast goats for steeds, Goat-borne! their gift who long for fame.

Sanskit Text: ओ षु तवा वव्र्तीमहि सतोमेभिर दस्म साधुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: o ṣu tvā vavṛtīmahi stomebhir dasma sādhubhiḥ |
Translation: So, Wonder-Worker! may we turn thee hither with effectual lauds.

Sanskit Text: नहि तवा पूषन्न अतिमन्य आघ्र्णे न ते सख्यम अपह्नुवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi tvā pūṣann atimanya āghṛṇe na te sakhyam apahnuve ||
Translation: I slight thee not, O Pūṣan, thou Resplendent One: thy friendship may not be despised.

Sanskit Text: अस्तु शरौषट पुरो अग्नीं धिया दध आ नु तच छर्धो दिव्यं वर्णीमह इन्द्रवायू वर्णीमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: astu śrauṣaṭ puro aghnīṃ dhiyā dadha ā nu tac chardho divyaṃ vṛṇīmaha indravāyū vṛṇīmahe |
Translation: 1. HEARD be our prayer! In thought I honour Agni first: now straightway we elect this heavenly company, Indra and Vāyu we elect.

Sanskit Text: यद ध कराणा विवस्वति नाभा संदायि नव्यसी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad dha krāṇā vivasvati nābhā saṃdāyi navyasī |
Translation: For when our latest thought is raised and on Vivasvān centred well,

Sanskit Text: अध पर सू न उप यन्तु धीतयो देवां अछा न धीतयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha pra sū na upa yantu dhītayo devāṃ achā na dhītayaḥ ||
Translation: Then may our holy songs go forward on their way, our songs as ’twere unto the Gods.

Sanskit Text: यद ध तयन मित्रावरुणाव रताद अध्य आददाथे अन्र्तं सवेन मन्युना दक्षस्य सवेन मन्युना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad dha tyan mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtād adhy ādadāthe anṛtaṃ svena manyunā dakṣasya svena manyunā |
Translation: 2 As there ye, Mitra, Varuṇa, above the true have taken to yourselves the untrue with your mind, with wisdom's mental energy,

Sanskit Text: युवोर इत्थाधि सद्मस्व अपश्याम हिरण्ययम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvor itthādhi sadmasv apaśyāma hiraṇyayam ||
Translation: So in the seats wherein ye dwell have we beheld the Golden One,

Sanskit Text: धीभिश चन मनसा सवेभिर अक्षभिः सोमस्य सवेभिर अक्षभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhībhiś cana manasā svebhir akṣabhiḥ somasya svebhir akṣabhiḥ ||
Translation: Not with our thoughts or spirit, but with these our eyes, yea, with the eyes that Soma gives.

Sanskit Text: युवां सतोमेभिर देवयन्तो अश्विनाश्रावयन्त इव शलोकम आयवो युवां हव्याभ्य आयवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvāṃ stomebhir devayanto aśvināśrāvayanta iva ślokam āyavo yuvāṃ havyābhy āyavaḥ |
Translation: 3 Aśvins, the pious call you with their hymns of praise, sounding their loud song forth to you, these living men, to their oblations, living men.

Sanskit Text: युवोर विश्वा अधि शरियः पर्क्षश च विश्ववेदसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvor viśvā adhi śriyaḥ pṛkṣaś ca viśvavedasā |
Translation: All glories and all nourishment, Lords of all wealth! depend on you.

Sanskit Text: परुषायन्ते वाम पवयो हिरण्यये रथे दस्रा हिरण्यये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pruṣāyante vām pavayo hiraṇyaye rathe dasrā hiraṇyaye ||
Translation: The fellies of your golden chariot scatter drops, Mighty Ones! of your golden car.

Sanskit Text: अचेति दस्रा वय  नाकम रण्वथो युञ्जते वां रथयुजो दिविष्टिष्व अध्वस्मानो दिविष्टिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aceti dasrā vy  nākam ṛṇvatho yuñjate vāṃ rathayujo diviṣṭiṣv adhvasmāno diviṣṭiṣu |
Translation: 4 Well is it known, O Mighty Ones: ye open heaven; for you the chariot-steeds are yoked for morning rites, unswerving steeds for morning rites,

Sanskit Text: अधि वां सथाम वन्धुरे रथे दस्रा हिरण्यये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi vāṃ sthāma vandhure rathe dasrā hiraṇyaye |
Translation: We set you on the chariot-seat, ye Mighty, on the golden car.

Sanskit Text: पथेव यन्ताव अनुशासता रजो ऽञजसा शासता रजः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: patheva yantāv anuśāsatā rajo 'ñjasā śāsatā rajaḥ ||
Translation: Ye seek mid-air as by a path that leads aright, as by a path that leads direct.

Sanskit Text: शचीभिर नः शचीवसू दिवा नक्तं दशस्यतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śacībhir naḥ śacīvasū divā naktaṃ daśasyatam |
Translation: 5 O Rich in Strength, through your great power vouchsafe us blessings day and night.

Sanskit Text: मा वां रातिर उप दसत कदा चनास्मद रातिः कदा चन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā vāṃ rātir upa dasat kadā canāsmad rātiḥ kadā cana ||
Translation: The offerings which we bring to you shall never fail, gifts brought by us shall never fail.

Sanskit Text: वर्षन्न इन्द्र वर्षपाणास इन्दव इमे सुता अद्रिषुतास उद्भिदस तुभ्यं सुतास उद्भिदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣann indra vṛṣapāṇāsa indava ime sutā adriṣutāsa udbhidas tubhyaṃ sutāsa udbhidaḥ |
Translation: 6 These Soma-drops, strong Indra! drink for heroes, poured, pressed out by pressing-stones, are welling forth for thee, for thee the drops are welling forth.

Sanskit Text: ते तवा मन्दन्तु दावने महे चित्राय राधसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te tvā mandantu dāvane mahe citrāya rādhase |
Translation: They shall make glad thy heart to give, to give wealth great and wonderful.

Sanskit Text: गीर्भिर गिर्वाह सतवमान आ गहि सुम्र्ळीको न आ गहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghīrbhir ghirvāha stavamāna ā ghahi sumṛḷīko na ā ghahi ||
Translation: Thou who acceptest praise come glorified by hymns, come thou to us benevolent.

Sanskit Text: ओ षू णो अग्ने शर्णुहि तवम ईळितो देवेभ्यो बरवसि यज्ञियेभ्यो राजभ्यो यज्ञियेभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: o ṣū ṇo aghne śṛṇuhi tvam īḷito devebhyo bravasi yajñiyebhyo rājabhyo yajñiyebhyaḥ |
Translation: 7 Quickly, O Agni, hear us: magnified by us thou shalt speck for us to the Gods adorable yea, to the Kings adorable:

Sanskit Text: यद ध तयाम अङगिरोभ्यो धेनुं देवा अदत्तन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad dha tyām aṅghirobhyo dhenuṃ devā adattana |
Translation: When, O ye Deities, ye gave that Milch-cow to the Aṅgirases,

Sanskit Text: वि तां दुह्रे अर्यमा कर्तरी सचां एष तां वेद मे सचा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi tāṃ duhre aryamā kartarī sacāṃ eṣa tāṃ veda me sacā ||
Translation: They milked her: Aryaman, joined with them, did the work: he knoweth her as well as I.

Sanskit Text: मो षु वो अस्मद अभि तानि पौंस्या सना भूवन दयुम्नानि मोत जारिषुर अस्मत पुरोत जारिषुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mo ṣu vo asmad abhi tāni pauṃsyā sanā bhūvan dyumnāni mota jāriṣur asmat purota jāriṣuḥ |
Translation: 8 Ne’er may these manly deeds of yours for us grow old, never may your bright glories fall into decay, never before our time decay.

Sanskit Text: यद वश चित्रं युगे-युगे नव्यं घोषाद अमर्त्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vaś citraṃ yughe-yughe navyaṃ ghoṣād amartyam |
Translation: What deed of yours, new every age, wondrous, surpassing man, rings forth,

Sanskit Text: अस्मासु तन मरुतो यच च दुष्टरं दिध्र्ता यच च दुष्टरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmāsu tan maruto yac ca duṣṭaraṃ didhṛtā yac ca duṣṭaram ||
Translation: Whatever, Maruts! may be difficult to gain, grant us, whate’er is hard to gain.

Sanskit Text: दध्यङ ह मे जनुषम पूर्वो अङगिराः परियमेधः कण्वो अत्रिर मनुर विदुस ते मे पूर्वे मनुर विदुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhyaṅ ha me januṣam pūrvo aṅghirāḥ priyamedhaḥ kaṇvo atrir manur vidus te me pūrve manur viduḥ |
Translation: 9 Dadhyac of old, Aṅgiras, Priyamedha these, and Kaṇva, Atri, Manu knew my birth, yea, those of ancient days and Manu knew.

Sanskit Text: तेषां देवेष्व आयतिर अस्माकं तेषु नाभयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: teṣāṃ deveṣv āyatir asmākaṃ teṣu nābhayaḥ |
Translation: Their long line stretcheth to the Gods, our birth-connexions are with them.

Sanskit Text: तेषाम पदेन मह्य आ नमे गिरेन्द्राग्नी आ नमे गिरा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: teṣām padena mahy ā name ghirendrāghnī ā name ghirā ||
Translation: To these, for their high station, I bow down with song, to Indra, Agni, bow with song.

Sanskit Text: होता यक्षद वनिनो वन्त वार्यम बर्हस्पतिर यजति वेन उक्षभिः पुरुवारेभिर उक्षभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotā yakṣad vanino vanta vāryam bṛhaspatir yajati vena ukṣabhiḥ puruvārebhir ukṣabhiḥ |
Translation: 10 Let the Invoker bless: let offerers bring choice gifts; Bṛhaspati the Friend doth sacrifice with Steers, Steers that have many an excellence.

Sanskit Text: जग्र्भ्मा दूरादिशं शलोकम अद्रेर अध तमना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jaghṛbhmā dūraādiśaṃ ślokam adrer adha tmanā |
Translation: Now with our ears we catch the sound of the press-stone that rings afar.

Sanskit Text: अधारयद अररिन्दानि सुक्रतुः पुरू सद्मानि सुक्रतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhārayad ararindāni sukratuḥ purū sadmāni sukratuḥ ||
Translation: The very Strong hath gained the waters by himself, the strong gained many a resting-place.

Sanskit Text: ये देवासो दिव्य एकादश सथ पर्थिव्याम अध्य एकादश सथ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye devāso divy ekādaśa stha pṛthivyām adhy ekādaśa stha |
Translation: 11 O ye Eleven Gods whose home is heaven, O ye Eleven who make earth your dwelling,

Sanskit Text: अप्सुक्षितो महिनैकादश सथ ते देवासो यज्ञम इमं जुषध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apsukṣito mahinaikādaśa stha te devāso yajñam imaṃ juṣadhvam ||
Translation: Ye who with might, Eleven, live in waters, accept this sacrifice, O Gods, with pleasure.

Sanskit Text: वेदिषदे परियधामाय सुद्युते धासिम इव पर भरा योनिम अग्नये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vediṣade priyadhāmāya sudyute dhāsim iva pra bharā yonim aghnaye |
Translation: 1. To splendid Agni seated by the altar, loving well his home, I bring the food as ’twere his place of birth.

Sanskit Text: वस्त्रेणेव वासया मन्मना शुचिं जयोतीरथं शुक्रवर्णं तमोहनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vastreṇeva vāsayā manmanā śuciṃ jyotīrathaṃ śukravarṇaṃ tamohanam ||
Translation: I clothe the bright One with my hymn as with a robe, him with the car of light, bright-hued, dispelling gloom.

Sanskit Text: अभि दविजन्मा तरिव्र्दन्नं रज्यते संवत्सरे वाव्र्धे जग्धमी पुनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi dvijanmā trivṛdannaṃ ṛjyate saṃvatsare vāvṛdhe jaghdhamī punaḥ |
Translation: 2 Child of a double birth he grasps at triple food; in the year's course what he hath swallowed grows anew.

Sanskit Text: अन्यस्यासा जिह्वय जेन्यो वर्षा नयन्येन वनिनोम्र्ष्ट वरणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anyasyāsā jihvaya jenyo vṛṣā nyanyena vaninomṛṣṭa varaṇaḥ ||
Translation: He, by another's mouth and tongue a noble Bull, with other, as an elephant, consumes the trees.

Sanskit Text: कर्ष्णप्रुतौ वेविजे अस्य सक्षिता उभा तरेते अभि मतरा शिशुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṣṇaprutau vevije asya sakṣitā ubhā tarete abhi matarā śiśum |
Translation: 3 The pair who dwell together, moving in the dark bestir themselves: both parents hasten to the babe,

Sanskit Text: पराचजिह्वं धवसयन्तं तर्षुच्युतमा साच्यं कुपयं वर्धनं पितुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prācajihvaṃ dhvasayantaṃ tṛṣucyutamā sācyaṃ kupayaṃ vardhanaṃ pituḥ ||
Translation: Impetuous-tongued, destroying, springing swiftly forth, one to be watched and cherished, strengthener of his sire.

Sanskit Text: मुमुक्ष्वो मनवे मनवस्यते रघुद्रुवः कर्ष्णसीतास ऊ जुवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mumukṣvo manave manavasyate raghudruvaḥ kṛṣṇasītāsa ū juvaḥ |
Translation: 4 For man, thou Friend of men, these steeds of thine are yoked, impatient, lightly running, ploughing blackened lines,

Sanskit Text: असमना अजिरासो रघुष्यदो वातजूता उप युज्यन्त आशवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asamanā ajirāso raghuṣyado vātajūtā upa yujyanta āśavaḥ ||
Translation: Discordant-minded, fleet, gliding with easy speed, urged onward by the wind and rapid in their course.

Sanskit Text: आदस्य ते धवसयन्तो वर्थेरते कर्ष्णमभ्वं महि वर्पःकरिक्रतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādasya te dhvasayanto vṛtherate kṛṣṇamabhvaṃ mahi varpaḥkarikrataḥ |
Translation: 5 Dispelling on their way the horror of black gloom, making a glorious show these flames of his fly forth,

Sanskit Text: यत सीं महीमवनिं पराभि मर्म्र्शदभिश्वसन सतनयन्नेति नानदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat sīṃ mahīmavaniṃ prābhi marmṛśadabhiśvasan stanayanneti nānadat ||
Translation: When o’er the spacious tract he spreads himself abroad, and rushes panting on with thunder and with roar.

Sanskit Text: भूषन न यो.अधि बभ्रूषु नम्नते वर्षेव पत्नीरभ्येति रोरुवत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūṣan na yo.adhi babhrūṣu namnate vṛṣeva patnīrabhyeti roruvat |
Translation: 6 Amid brown plants he stoops as if adorning them, and rushes bellowing like a bull upon his wives.

Sanskit Text: ओजायमानस्तन्वश्च शुम्भते भीमो न शर्न्गादविधव दुर्ग्र्भिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ojāyamānastanvaśca śumbhate bhīmo na śṛnghādavidhava durghṛbhiḥ ||
Translation: Proving his might, he decks the glory of his form, and shakes his horns like one terrific, hard to stay.

Sanskit Text: स संस्तिरो विष्टिरः सं गर्भयति जनन्नेव जानतीर्नित्य आ शये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa saṃstiro viṣṭiraḥ saṃ ghṛbhayati jananneva jānatīrnitya ā śaye |
Translation: 7 Now covered, now displayed he grasps as one who knows his resting-place in those who know him well.

Sanskit Text: पुनर्वर्धन्ते अपि यन्ति देव्यमन्यद वर्पः पित्रोः कर्ण्वते सचा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punarvardhante api yanti devyamanyad varpaḥ pitroḥ kṛṇvate sacā ||
Translation: A second time they wax and gather Godlike power, and blending both together change their Parents' form.

Sanskit Text: तमग्रुवः केशिनीः सं हि रेभिर ऊर्ध्वास्तस्थुर्मम्रुषीः परायवे पुनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamaghruvaḥ keśinīḥ saṃ hi rebhira ūrdhvāstasthurmamruṣīḥ prāyave punaḥ |
Translation: 8 The maidens with long, tresses hold him in embrace; dead, they rise up again to meet the Living One.

Sanskit Text: तासां जरां परमुञ्चन्नेति नानददसुं परं जनयञ जीवमस्त्र्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāsāṃ jarāṃ pramuñcanneti nānadadasuṃ paraṃ janayañ jīvamastṛtam ||
Translation: Releasing them from age with a loud roar he comes, filling them with new spirit, living, unsubdued.

Sanskit Text: अधीवसं परि मतु रिहन्नह तुविग्रेभिः सत्वभिर्याति वि जरयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhīvasaṃ pari matu rihannaha tuvighrebhiḥ satvabhiryāti vi jrayaḥ |
Translation: 9 Licking the mantle of the Mother, far and wide he wanders over fields with beasts that flee apace.

Sanskit Text: वयो दधत पद्वते रेरिहत सदानु शयेनी सचतेवर्तनीरह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayo dadhat padvate rerihat sadānu śyenī sacatevartanīraha ||
Translation: Strengthening all that walk, licking up all around, a blackened path, forsooth, he leaves where’er he goes.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकमग्ने मघवत्सु दीदिह्यध शवसीवान वर्षभो दमूनाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākamaghne maghavatsu dīdihyadha śvasīvān vṛṣabho damūnāḥ |
Translation: 10 O Agni, shine resplendent with our wealthy chiefs, like a loud-snorting bull, accustomed to the house.

Sanskit Text: अवास्या शिशुमतीरदीदेर्वर्मेव युत्सु परिजर्भुराणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avāsyā śiśumatīradīdervarmeva yutsu parijarbhurāṇaḥ ||
Translation: Thou casting off thine infant wrappings blazest forth as though thou hadst put on a coat of mail for war.

Sanskit Text: इदमग्ने सुधितं दुर्धितादधि परियादु चिन मन्मनः परेयो अस्तु ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idamaghne sudhitaṃ durdhitādadhi priyādu cin manmanaḥ preyo astu te |
Translation: 11 May this our perfect prayer be dearer unto thee than an imperfect prayer although it please thee well.

Sanskit Text: यत ते शुक्रं तन्वो रोचते शुचि तेनास्मभ्यंवनसे रत्नमा तवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te śukraṃ tanvo rocate śuci tenāsmabhyaṃvanase ratnamā tvam ||
Translation: With the pure brilliancy that radiates from thy form, mayest thou grant to us abundant store of wealth.

Sanskit Text: रथाय नावमुत नो गर्हाय नित्यारित्रां पद्वतीं रास्यग्ने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathāya nāvamuta no ghṛhāya nityāritrāṃ padvatīṃ rāsyaghne |
Translation: 12 Grant to our chariot, to our house, O Agni, a boat with moving feet and constant oarage,

Sanskit Text: अस्माकं वीरानुत नो मघोनो जनांश्च या] पारयाच्छर्म या च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākaṃ vīrānuta no maghono janāṃśca yā] pārayāccharma yā ca ||
Translation: One that may further well our wealthy princes and all the folk, and be our certain refuge.

Sanskit Text: अभी नो अग्न उक्थमिज्जुगुर्या दयावाक्षामा सिन्धवश्च सवगूर्ताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhī no aghna ukthamijjughuryā dyāvākṣāmā sindhavaśca svaghūrtāḥ |
Translation: 13 Welcome our laud with thine approval, Agni. May earth and heaven and freely flowing rivers

Sanskit Text: गव्यं यव्यं यन्तो दीर्घाहेषं वरमरुण्यो वरन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghavyaṃ yavyaṃ yanto dīrghāheṣaṃ varamaruṇyo varanta ||
Translation: Yield us long life and food and corn and cattle, and may the red Dawns choose for us their choicest.

Sanskit Text: बळ इत्था तद वपुषे धायि दर्शतं देवस्य भर्गः सहसो यतो जनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: baḷ itthā tad vapuṣe dhāyi darśataṃ devasya bharghaḥ sahaso yato jani |
Translation: 1. YEA, verily, the fair effulgence of the God for glory was established, since he sprang from strength.

Sanskit Text: यदीमुप हवरते साधते मतिर्र्तस्य धेन अनयन्त सस्रुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadīmupa hvarate sādhate matirṛtasya dhena anayanta sasrutaḥ ||
Translation: When he inclines thereto successful is the hymn: the songs of sacrifice have brought him as they flow

Sanskit Text: पर्क्षो वपुः पितुमान नित्य आ शये दवितीयमा सप्तशिवासु मात्र्षु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛkṣo vapuḥ pitumān nitya ā śaye dvitīyamā saptaśivāsu mātṛṣu |
Translation: 2 Wonderful, rich in nourishment, he dwells in food; next, in the seven auspicious Mothers is his home.

Sanskit Text: तर्तीयमस्य वर्षभस्य दोहसे दशप्रमतिं जनयन्त योषणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tṛtīyamasya vṛṣabhasya dohase daśapramatiṃ janayanta yoṣaṇaḥ ||
Translation: Thirdly, that they might drain the treasures of the Bull, the maidens brought forth him for whom the ten provide.

Sanskit Text: निर्यदीं बुध्नान महिषस्य वर्पस ईशानासः शवसाक्रन्त सूरयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: niryadīṃ budhnān mahiṣasya varpasa īśānāsaḥ śavasākranta sūrayaḥ |
Translation: 3 What time from out the deep, from the Steer's wondrous form, the Chiefs who had the power produced him with their strength;

Sanskit Text: यदीमनु परदिवो मध्व आधवे गुहा सन्तं मातरिश्वा मथायति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadīmanu pradivo madhva ādhave ghuhā santaṃ mātariśvā mathāyati ||
Translation: When Mātariśvan rubbed forth him who lay concealed, for mixture of the sweet drink, in the days of old.

Sanskit Text: पर यत पितुः परमान नीयते पर्या पर्क्षुधो वीरुधो दंसु रोहति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yat pituḥ paramān nīyate paryā pṛkṣudho vīrudho daṃsu rohati |
Translation: 4 When from the Highest Father he is brought to us, amid the plants he rises hungry, wondrously.

Sanskit Text: उभा यदस्य जनुषं यदिन्वत आदिद यविष्ठो अभवद घर्णा शुचिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhā yadasya januṣaṃ yadinvata ādid yaviṣṭho abhavad ghṛṇā śuciḥ ||
Translation: As both together join to expedite his birth, most youthful he is born resplendent in his light.

Sanskit Text: आदिन मातॄराविशद यास्वा शुचिरहिंस्यमान उर्वियावि वाव्र्धे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādin mātṝrāviśad yāsvā śucirahiṃsyamāna urviyāvi vāvṛdhe |
Translation: 5 Then also entered he the Mothers, and in them pure and uninjured he increased in magnitude.

Sanskit Text: अनु यत पूर्वा अरुहत सनाजुवो नि नव्यसीष्ववरासु धावते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu yat pūrvā aruhat sanājuvo ni navyasīṣvavarāsu dhāvate ||
Translation: As to the first he rose, the vigorous from of old, so now he runs among the younger lowest ones.

Sanskit Text: आदिद धोतारं वर्णते दिविष्टिषु भगमिव पप्र्चानास रञ्जते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādid dhotāraṃ vṛṇate diviṣṭiṣu bhaghamiva papṛcānāsa ṛñjate |
Translation: 6 Therefore they choose him Herald at the morning rites, pressing to him as unto Bhaga, pouring gifts,

Sanskit Text: देवान यत करत्वा मज्मना पुरुष्टुतो मर्तं संसं विश्वधा वेति धायसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devān yat kratvā majmanā puruṣṭuto martaṃ saṃsaṃ viśvadhā veti dhāyase ||
Translation: When, much-praised, by the power and will of Gods, he goes at all times to his mortal worshipper to drink.

Sanskit Text: वि यदस्थाद यजतो वातचोदितो हवारो न वक्वा जरणा अनाक्र्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yadasthād yajato vātacodito hvāro na vakvā jaraṇā anākṛtaḥ |
Translation: 7 What time the Holy One, wind-urged, hath risen up, serpent-like winding through the dry grass unrestrained,

Sanskit Text: तस्य पत्मन दक्षुषः कर्ष्णजंहसः शुचिजन्मनो रज आ वयध्वनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya patman dakṣuṣaḥ kṛṣṇajaṃhasaḥ śucijanmano raja ā vyadhvanaḥ ||
Translation: Dust lies upon the way of him who burneth all, black-winged and pure of birth who follows sundry paths.

Sanskit Text: रथो न यातः शिक्वभिः कर्तो दयामङगेभिररुषेभिरीयते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ratho na yātaḥ śikvabhiḥ kṛto dyāmaṅghebhiraruṣebhirīyate |
Translation: 8 Like a swift chariot made by men who know their art, he with his red limbs lifts himself aloft to heaven.

Sanskit Text: आदस्य ते कर्ष्णासो दक्षि सूरयः शूरस्येव तवेषथादीषते वयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādasya te kṛṣṇāso dakṣi sūrayaḥ śūrasyeva tveṣathādīṣate vayaḥ ||
Translation: Thy worshippers become by burning black of hue: their strength flies as before a hero's violence.

Sanskit Text: तवया हयग्ने वरुणो धर्तव्रतो मित्रः शाशद्रे अर्यमा सुदानवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā hyaghne varuṇo dhṛtavrato mitraḥ śāśadre aryamā sudānavaḥ |
Translation: 9 By thee, O Agni, Varuṇa who guards the Law, Mitra and Aryaman, the Bounteous, are made strong;

Sanskit Text: यत सीमनु करतुना विश्वथा विभुररान न नेमिः परिभूरजायथाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat sīmanu kratunā viśvathā vibhurarān na nemiḥ paribhūrajāyathāḥ ||
Translation: For, as the felly holds the spokes, thou with thy might pervading hast been born encompassing them round.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने शशमानाय सुन्वते रत्नं यविष्ठ देवतातिमिन्वसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne śaśamānāya sunvate ratnaṃ yaviṣṭha devatātiminvasi |
Translation: 10 Agni, to him who toils and pours libations, thou, Most Youthful! sendest wealth and all the host of Gods.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा नु नव्यं सहसो युवन वयं भगं न कारेमहिरत्न धीमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā nu navyaṃ sahaso yuvan vayaṃ bhaghaṃ na kāremahiratna dhīmahi ||
Translation: Thee, therefore, even as Bhaga, will we set anew, young Child of Strength, most wealthy! in our battle-song.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे रयिं न सवर्थं दमूनसं भगं दक्षं न पप्र्चासि धर्णसिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme rayiṃ na svarthaṃ damūnasaṃ bhaghaṃ dakṣaṃ na papṛcāsi dharṇasim |
Translation: 11 Vouchsafe us riches turned to worthy ends, good luck abiding in the house, and strong capacity,

Sanskit Text: रश्मीन्रिव यो यमति जन्मनी उभे देवानां शंसं रत आ च सुक्रतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: raśmīnriva yo yamati janmanī ubhe devānāṃ śaṃsaṃ ṛta ā ca sukratuḥ ||
Translation: Wealth that directs both worlds as they were guiding-reins, and, very Wise, the Gods’ assent in sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: उत नः सुद्योत्मा जीराश्वो होता मन्द्रः शर्णवच्चन्द्ररथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta naḥ sudyotmā jīrāśvo hotā mandraḥ śṛṇavaccandrarathaḥ |
Translation: 12 May he, the Priest resplendent, joyful, hear us, he with the radiant car and rapid horses.

Sanskit Text: स नो नेषन नेषतमैरमूरो.अग्निर्वामं सुवितं वस्यो अछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no neṣan neṣatamairamūro.aghnirvāmaṃ suvitaṃ vasyo acha ||
Translation: May Agni, ever wise, with best directions to bliss and highest happiness conduct us.

Sanskit Text: अस्ताव्यग्निः शिमीवद्भिरर्कैः साम्राज्याय परतरं दधानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: astāvyaghniḥ śimīvadbhirarkaiḥ sāmrājyāya prataraṃ dadhānaḥ |
Translation: 13 With hymns of might hath Agni now been lauded, advanced to height of universal kingship.

Sanskit Text: अमी च ये मघवानो वयं च मिहं न सूरो अतिनिष टतन्युः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: amī ca ye maghavāno vayaṃ ca mihaṃ na sūro atiniṣ ṭatanyuḥ ||
Translation: Now may these wealthy chiefs and we together spread forth as spreads the Sun above the rain-clouds.

Sanskit Text: पर तव्यसीं नव्यसीं धीतिमग्नये वाचो मतिं सहसःसूनवे भरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra tavyasīṃ navyasīṃ dhītimaghnaye vāco matiṃ sahasaḥsūnave bhare |
Translation: 1. To Agni I present a newer mightier hymn, I bring my words and song unto the Son of Strength,

Sanskit Text: अपां नपाद यो वसुभिः सह परियो होता पर्थिव्यां नयसीदद रत्वियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāṃ napād yo vasubhiḥ saha priyo hotā pṛthivyāṃ nyasīdad ṛtviyaḥ ||
Translation: Who, Offspring of the Waters, bearing precious things sits on the earth, in season, dear Invoking Priest.

Sanskit Text: स जायमानः परमे वयोमन्याविरग्निरभवन मातरिश्वने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyomanyāviraghnirabhavan mātariśvane |
Translation: 2 Soon as he sprang to birth that Agni was shown forth to Mātariśvan in the highest firmament.

Sanskit Text: अस्य करत्वा समिधानस्य मज्मना पर दयावा शोचिः पर्थिवी अरोचयत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya kratvā samidhānasya majmanā pra dyāvā śociḥ pṛthivī arocayat ||
Translation: When he was kindled, through his power and majesty his fiery splendour made the heavens and earth to shine.

Sanskit Text: अस्य तवेषा अजरा अस्य भानवः सुसन्द्र्शः सुप्रतीकस्यसुद्युतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya tveṣā ajarā asya bhānavaḥ susandṛśaḥ supratīkasyasudyutaḥ |
Translation: 3 His flames that wax not old, beams fair to look upon of him whose face is lovely, shine with beauteous sheen.

Sanskit Text: भात्वक्षसो अत्यक्तुर्न सिन्धवो.अग्ने रेजन्ते अससन्तो अजराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhātvakṣaso atyakturna sindhavo.aghne rejante asasanto ajarāḥ ||
Translation: The rays of Agni, him whose active force is light, through the nights glimmer sleepless, ageless, like the floods.

Sanskit Text: यमेरिरे भर्गवो विश्ववेदसं नाभा पर्थिव्या भुवनस्य मज्मना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamerire bhṛghavo viśvavedasaṃ nābhā pṛthivyā bhuvanasya majmanā |
Translation: 4 Send thou with hymns that Agni to his own abode, who rules, one Sovran Lord of wealth, like Varuṇa,

Sanskit Text: अग्निं तं गीर्भिर्हिनुहि सव आ दमे य एको वस्वो वरुणो न राजति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ taṃ ghīrbhirhinuhi sva ā dame ya eko vasvo varuṇo na rājati ||
Translation: Him, All-possessor, whom the Bhṛgus with their might brought to earth's central point, the centre of the world.

Sanskit Text: न यो वराय मरुतामिव सवनः सेनेव सर्ष्टा दिव्या यथाशनिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yo varāya marutāmiva svanaḥ seneva sṛṣṭā divyā yathāśaniḥ |
Translation: 5 He whom no force can stay, even as the Maruts’ roar, like to a dart sent forth, even as the bolt from heaven,

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्जम्भैस्तिगितैरत्ति भर्वति योधो न शत्रून स वना नय रञ्जते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirjambhaistighitairatti bharvati yodho na śatrūn sa vanā ny ṛñjate ||
Translation: Agni with sharpened jaws chews up and eats the trees, and conquers them as when the warrior smites his foes.

Sanskit Text: कुविन नो अग्निरुचथस्य वीरसद वसुष कुविद वसुभिः काममावरत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvin no aghnirucathasya vīrasad vasuṣ kuvid vasubhiḥ kāmamāvarat |
Translation: 6 And will not Agni find enjoyment in our praise, will not the Vasu grant our wish with gifts of wealth?

Sanskit Text: चोदः कुवित तुतुज्यात सातये धियः शुचिप्रतीकं तमया धिया गर्णे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: codaḥ kuvit tutujyāt sātaye dhiyaḥ śucipratīkaṃ tamayā dhiyā ghṛṇe ||
Translation: Will not the Inspirer speed our prayers to gain their end? Him with the radiant glance I laud with this my song.

Sanskit Text: घर्तप्रतीकं व रतस्य धूर्षदमग्निं मित्रं न समिधान रञ्जते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtapratīkaṃ va ṛtasya dhūrṣadamaghniṃ mitraṃ na samidhāna ṛñjate |
Translation: 7 The kindler of the flame wins Agni as a Friend, promoter of the Law, whose face is bright with oil.

Sanskit Text: इन्धानो अक्रो विदथेषु दीद्यच्छुक्रवर्णामुदु नो यंसते धियम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indhāno akro vidatheṣu dīdyacchukravarṇāmudu no yaṃsate dhiyam ||
Translation: Inflamed and keen, refulgent in our gatherings, he lifts our hymn on high clad in his radiant hues.

Sanskit Text: अप्रयुछन्नप्रयुछद्भिरग्ने शिवेभिर्नः पायुभिः पाहि शग्मैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aprayuchannaprayuchadbhiraghne śivebhirnaḥ pāyubhiḥ pāhi śaghmaiḥ |
Translation: 8 Keep us incessantly with guards that cease not, Agni, with guards auspicious, very mighty.

Sanskit Text: अदब्धेभिरद्र्पितेभिरिष्टे.अनिमिषद्भिः परि पाहि नो जाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adabdhebhiradṛpitebhiriṣṭe.animiṣadbhiḥ pari pāhi no jāḥ ||
Translation: With guards that never slumber, never heedless, never beguiled. O Helper, keep our children.

Sanskit Text: एति पर होता वरतमस्य माययोर्ध्वां दधानः शुचिपेशसं धियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eti pra hotā vratamasya māyayordhvāṃ dadhānaḥ śucipeśasaṃ dhiyam |
Translation: 1. THE Priest goes forth to sacrifice, with wondrous power sending aloft the hymn of glorious brilliancy.

Sanskit Text: अभि सरुचः करमते दक्षिणाव्र्तो या अस्य धाम परथमं ह निंसते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi srucaḥ kramate dakṣiṇāvṛto yā asya dhāma prathamaṃ ha niṃsate ||
Translation: He moves to meet the ladles turning to the right, which are the first to kiss the place where he abides.

Sanskit Text: अभीं रतस्य दोहना अनूषत योनौ देवस्य सदने परीव्र्ताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhīṃ ṛtasya dohanā anūṣata yonau devasya sadane parīvṛtāḥ |
Translation: 2 To him sang forth the flowing streams of Holy Law, encompassed in the home and birth-place of the God.

Sanskit Text: अपामुपस्थे विभ्र्तो यदावसदध सवधा अधयद याभिरीयते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāmupasthe vibhṛto yadāvasadadha svadhā adhayad yābhirīyate ||
Translation: He, when he dwelt extended in the waters’ lap, absorbed those Godlike powers for which he is adored.

Sanskit Text: युयूषतः सवयसा तदिद वपुः समानमर्थं वितरित्रता मिथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuyūṣataḥ savayasā tadid vapuḥ samānamarthaṃ vitaritratā mithaḥ |
Translation: 3 Seeking in course altern to reach the selfsame end the two copartners strive to win this beauteous form.

Sanskit Text: आदीं भगो न हव्यः समस्मदा वोळ्हुर्न रश्मीन समयंस्त सारथिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādīṃ bhagho na havyaḥ samasmadā voḷhurna raśmīn samayaṃsta sārathiḥ ||
Translation: Like Bhaga must he be duly invoked by us, as he who drives the car holds fast the horse's reins.

Sanskit Text: यमीं दवा सवयसा सपर्यतः समाने योना मिथुना समोकसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamīṃ dvā savayasā saparyataḥ samāne yonā mithunā samokasā |
Translation: 4 He whom the two copartners with observance tend, the pair who dwell together in the same abode,

Sanskit Text: दिवा न नक्तं पलितो युवाजनि पुरू चरन्नजरो मानुषा युगा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divā na naktaṃ palito yuvājani purū carannajaro mānuṣā yughā ||
Translation: By night as in the day the grey one was born young, passing untouched by eld through many an age of man.

Sanskit Text: तमीं हिन्वन्ति धीतयो दश वरिशो देवं मर्तास ऊतये हवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamīṃ hinvanti dhītayo daśa vriśo devaṃ martāsa ūtaye havāmahe |
Translation: 5 Him the ten fingers, the devotions, animate: we mortals call on him a God to give us help.

Sanskit Text: धनोरधि परवत आ स रण्वत्यभिव्रजद्भिर्वयुना नवाधित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhanoradhi pravata ā sa ṛṇvatyabhivrajadbhirvayunā navādhita ||
Translation: He speeds over the sloping surface of the land: new deeds hath he performed with those who gird him round.

Sanskit Text: तवं हयग्ने दिव्यस्य राजसि तवं पार्थिवस्य पशुपा इव तमना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hyaghne divyasya rājasi tvaṃ pārthivasya paśupā iva tmanā |
Translation: 6 For, Agni, like a herdsman, thou by thine own might rulest o’er all that is in heaven and on the earth;

Sanskit Text: एनी त एते बर्हती अभिश्रिया हिरण्ययी वक्वरी बर्हिराशाते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: enī ta ete bṛhatī abhiśriyā hiraṇyayī vakvarī barhirāśāte ||
Translation: And these two Mighty Ones, bright, golden closely joined, rolling them round are come unto thy sacred grass.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने जुषस्व परति हर्य तद वचो मन्द्र सवधाव रतजात सुक्रतो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne juṣasva prati harya tad vaco mandra svadhāva ṛtajāta sukrato |
Translation: 7 Agni, accept with joy, be glad in this our prayer, joy-giver, self-sustained, strong, born of Holy Law!

Sanskit Text: यो विश्वतः पर्त्यंं असि दर्शतो रण्वः सन्द्र्ष्टौ पितुमानिव कषयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo viśvataḥ partyaṃṃ asi darśato raṇvaḥ sandṛṣṭau pitumāniva kṣayaḥ ||
Translation: For fair to see art thou turning to every side, pleasant to look on as a dwelling filled with food.

Sanskit Text: तं पर्छता स जगामा स वेद स चिकित्वानीयते सा नवीयते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ pṛchatā sa jaghāmā sa veda sa cikitvānīyate sā nvīyate |
Translation: 1. Ask ye of him for he is come, he knoweth it; he, full of wisdom, is implored, is now implored.

Sanskit Text: तस्मिन सन्ति परशिषस्तस्मिन्निष्टयः स वाजस्य शवसः शुष्मिणस पतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmin santi praśiṣastasminniṣṭayaḥ sa vājasya śavasaḥ śuṣmiṇas patiḥ ||
Translation: With him are admonitions and with him commands: he is the Lord of Strength, the Lord of Power and Might.

Sanskit Text: तमित पर्छन्ति न सिमो वि पर्छति सवेनेव धीरो मनसा यदग्रभीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamit pṛchanti na simo vi pṛchati sveneva dhīro manasā yadaghrabhīt |
Translation: 2 They ask of him: not all learn by their questioning what he, the Sage, hath grasped, as ’twere, with his own mind.

Sanskit Text: न मर्ष्यते परथमं नापरं वचो.अस्य करत्वसचते अप्रद्र्पितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na mṛṣyate prathamaṃ nāparaṃ vaco.asya kratvasacate apradṛpitaḥ ||
Translation: Forgetting not the former nor the later word, he goeth on, not careless, in his mental power.

Sanskit Text: तमिद गछन्ति जुह्वस्तमर्वतीर्विश्वान्येकः शर्णवद वचांसि मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamid ghachanti juhvastamarvatīrviśvānyekaḥ śṛṇavad vacāṃsi me |
Translation: 3 To him these ladles go, to him these racing mares: he only will give ear to all the words I speak.

Sanskit Text: पुरुप्रैषस्ततुरिर्यज्ञसाधनो.अछिद्रोतिः शिशुरादत्त सं रभः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purupraiṣastaturiryajñasādhano.achidrotiḥ śiśurādatta saṃ rabhaḥ ||
Translation: All-speeding, victor, perfecter of sacrifice, the Babe with flawless help hath mustered vigorous might.

Sanskit Text: उपस्थायं चरति यत समारत सद्यो जातस्तत्सार युज्येभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upasthāyaṃ carati yat samārata sadyo jātastatsāra yujyebhiḥ |
Translation: 4 Whate’er he meets he grasps and then runs farther on, and straightway, newly born, creeps forward with his kin.

Sanskit Text: अभि शवान्तं मर्शते नान्द्ये मुदे यदीं गछन्त्युशतीरपिष्ठितम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi śvāntaṃ mṛśate nāndye mude yadīṃ ghachantyuśatīrapiṣṭhitam ||
Translation: He stirs the wearied man to pleasure and great joy what time the longing gifts approach him as he comes.

Sanskit Text: स ईं मर्गो अप्यो वनर्गुरुप तवच्युपमस्यां नि धायि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa īṃ mṛgho apyo vanarghurupa tvacyupamasyāṃ ni dhāyi |
Translation: 5 He is a wild thing of the flood and forest: he hath been laid upon the highest surface.

Sanskit Text: वयब्रवीद वयुना मर्त्येभ्यो.अग्निर्विद्वान रतचिद धि सत्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyabravīd vayunā martyebhyo.aghnirvidvān ṛtacid dhi satyaḥ ||
Translation: He hath declared the lore of works to mortals, Agni the Wise, for he knows Law, the Truthful.

Sanskit Text: तरिमूर्धानं सप्तरश्मिं गर्णीषे.अनूनमग्निं पित्रोरुपस्थे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trimūrdhānaṃ saptaraśmiṃ ghṛṇīṣe.anūnamaghniṃ pitrorupasthe |
Translation: 1. I LAUD the seven-rayed, the triple-headed, Agni all-perfect in his Parents’ bosom,

Sanskit Text: निषत्तमस्य चरतो धरुवस्य विश्वा दिवो रोचनापप्रिवांसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niṣattamasya carato dhruvasya viśvā divo rocanāpaprivāṃsam ||
Translation: Sunk in the lap of all that moves and moves not, him who hath filled all luminous realms of heaven.

Sanskit Text: उक्षा महानभि ववक्ष एने अजरस्तस्थावितूतिर्र्ष्वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukṣā mahānabhi vavakṣa ene ajarastasthāvitaūtirṛṣvaḥ |
Translation: 2 As a great Steer he grew to these his Parents; sublime he stands, untouched by eld, far-reaching.

Sanskit Text: उर्व्याः पदो नि दधाति सानौ रिहन्त्यूधो अरुषासो अस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: urvyāḥ pado ni dadhāti sānau rihantyūdho aruṣāso asya ||
Translation: He plants his footsteps on the lofty ridges of the broad earth: his red flames lick the udder.

Sanskit Text: समानं वत्समभि संचरन्ती विष्वग धेनू वि चरतः सुमेके |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samānaṃ vatsamabhi saṃcarantī viṣvagh dhenū vi carataḥ sumeke |
Translation: 3 Coming together to their common youngling both Cows, fairshaped, spread forth in all directions,

Sanskit Text: अनपव्र्ज्यानध्वनो मिमाने विश्वान केतानधि महोदधाने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anapavṛjyānadhvano mimāne viśvān ketānadhi mahodadhāne ||
Translation: Measuring out the paths that must be travelled, entrusting all desires to him the Mighty.

Sanskit Text: धीरासः पदं कवयो नयन्ति नाना हर्दा रक्षमाणा अजुर्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhīrāsaḥ padaṃ kavayo nayanti nānā hṛdā rakṣamāṇā ajuryam |
Translation: 4 The prudent sages lead him to his dwelling, guarding with varied skill the Ever-Youthful.

Sanskit Text: सिषासन्तः पर्यपश्यन्त सिन्धुमाविरेभ्यो अभवत्सूर्यो नॄन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: siṣāsantaḥ paryapaśyanta sindhumāvirebhyo abhavatsūryo nṝn ||
Translation: Longing, they turned their eyes unto the River: to these the Sun of men was manifested.

Sanskit Text: दिद्र्क्षेण्यः परि काष्ठासु जेन्य ईळेन्यो महो अर्भाय जीवसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: didṛkṣeṇyaḥ pari kāṣṭhāsu jenya īḷenyo maho arbhāya jīvase |
Translation: 5 Born noble in the regions, aim of all mens’ eyes to be implored for life by great and small alike,

Sanskit Text: पुरुत्रा यदभवत सूरहैभ्यो गर्भेभ्यो मघवा विश्वदर्शतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purutrā yadabhavat sūrahaibhyo gharbhebhyo maghavā viśvadarśataḥ ||
Translation: Far as the Wealthy One hath spread himself abroad, he is the Sire all-visible of this progeny.

Sanskit Text: कथा ते अग्ने शुचयन्त आयोर्ददाशुर्वाजेभिराशुषाणाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kathā te aghne śucayanta āyordadāśurvājebhirāśuṣāṇāḥ |
Translation: 1. How, Agni, have the radiant ones, aspiring, endued thee with the vigour of the living,

Sanskit Text: उभे यत तोके तनये दधाना रतस्य सामन रणयन्तदेवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhe yat toke tanaye dadhānā ṛtasya sāman raṇayantadevāḥ ||
Translation: So that on both sides fostering seed and offspring, the Gods may joy in Holy Law's fulfilment?

Sanskit Text: बोधा मे अस्य वचसो यविष्ठ मंहिष्ठस्य परभ्र्तस्य सवधावः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bodhā me asya vacaso yaviṣṭha maṃhiṣṭhasya prabhṛtasya svadhāvaḥ |
Translation: 2 Mark this my speech, Divine One, thou, Most Youthful! offered to thee by him who gives most freely.

Sanskit Text: पीयति तवो अनु तवो गर्णाति वन्दारुस्ते तन्वं वन्देग्ने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pīyati tvo anu tvo ghṛṇāti vandāruste tanvaṃ vandeaghne ||
Translation: One hates thee, and another sings thy praises: I thine adorer laud thy form, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: ये पायवो मामतेयं ते अग्ने पश्यन्तो अन्धं दुरितादरक्षन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye pāyavo māmateyaṃ te aghne paśyanto andhaṃ duritādarakṣan |
Translation: 3 Thy guardian rays, O Agni, when they saw him, preserved blind Māmateya from affliction.

Sanskit Text: ररक्ष तान सुक्र्तो विश्ववेदा दिप्सन्त इद रिपवो नाह देभुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rarakṣa tān sukṛto viśvavedā dipsanta id ripavo nāha debhuḥ ||
Translation: Lord of all riches, he preserved the pious the foes who fain would harm them did no mischief.

Sanskit Text: यो नो अग्ने अररिवानघायुररातीवा मर्चयति दवयेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo no aghne ararivānaghāyurarātīvā marcayati dvayena |
Translation: 4 The sinful man who worships not, O Agni, who, offering not, harms us with double-dealing,—

Sanskit Text: मन्त्रो गुरुः पुनरस्तु सो अस्मा अनु मर्क्षीष्ट तन्वं दुरुक्तैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mantro ghuruḥ punarastu so asmā anu mṛkṣīṣṭa tanvaṃ duruktaiḥ ||
Translation: Be this in turn to him a heavy sentence: may he distress himself by his revilings.

Sanskit Text: उत वा यः सहस्य परविद्वान मर्तो मर्तं मर्चयति दवयेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta vā yaḥ sahasya pravidvān marto martaṃ marcayati dvayena |
Translation: 5 Yea, when a mortal knowingly, O Victor, injures with double tongue a fellow-mortal,

Sanskit Text: अतः पाहि सतवमान सतुवन्तमग्ने माकिर्नो दुरिताय धायीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ataḥ pāhi stavamāna stuvantamaghne mākirno duritāya dhāyīḥ ||
Translation: From him, praised Agni! save thou him that lauds thee: bring us not into trouble and affliction.

Sanskit Text: मथीद यदीं विष्टो मातरिश्वा होतारं विश्वाप्सुं विश्वदेव्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mathīd yadīṃ viṣṭo mātariśvā hotāraṃ viśvāpsuṃ viśvadevyam |
Translation: 1. WHAT Mātariśvan, piercing, formed by friction, Herald of all the Gods. in varied figure,

Sanskit Text: नि यं दधुर्मनुष्यासु विक्षु सवर्ण चित्रं वपुषे विभावम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni yaṃ dadhurmanuṣyāsu vikṣu svarṇa citraṃ vapuṣe vibhāvam ||
Translation: Is he whom they have set mid human houses, gay-hued as light and shining forth for beauty.

Sanskit Text: ददानमिन न ददभन्त मन्माग्निर्वरूथं मम तस्य चाकन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadānamin na dadabhanta manmāghnirvarūthaṃ mama tasya cākan |
Translation: 2 They shall not harm the man who brings thee praises: such as I am, Agni my help approves me.

Sanskit Text: जुषन्त विश्वन्यस्य कर्मोपस्तुतिं भरमाणस्य कारोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣanta viśvanyasya karmopastutiṃ bharamāṇasya kāroḥ ||
Translation: All acts of mine shall they accept with pleasure, laudation from the singer who presents it.

Sanskit Text: नित्ये चिन नु यं सदने जग्र्भ्रे परशस्तिभिर्दधिरे यज्ञियसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nitye cin nu yaṃ sadane jaghṛbhre praśastibhirdadhire yajñiyasaḥ |
Translation: 3 Him in his constant seat men skilled in worship have taken and with praises have established.

Sanskit Text: पर सू नयन्त गर्भयन्त इष्टावश्वासो न रथ्योररहणाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sū nayanta ghṛbhayanta iṣṭāvaśvāso na rathyorarahaṇāḥ ||
Translation: As, harnessed to a chariot fleet-foot horses, at his command let bearers lead him forward.

Sanskit Text: पुरूणि दस्मो नि रिणाति जम्भैराद रोचते वन आ विभावा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purūṇi dasmo ni riṇāti jambhairād rocate vana ā vibhāvā |
Translation: 4 Wondrous, full many a thing he chews and crunches: he shines amid the wood with spreading brightness.

Sanskit Text: आदस्य वातो अनु वाति शोचिरस्तुर्न शर्यामसनामनु दयून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādasya vāto anu vāti śocirasturna śaryāmasanāmanu dyūn ||
Translation: Upon his glowing flames the wind blows daily, driving them like the keen shaft of an archer.

Sanskit Text: न यं रिपवो न रिषण्यवो गर्भे सन्तं रेषणा रेषयन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yaṃ ripavo na riṣaṇyavo gharbhe santaṃ reṣaṇā reṣayanti |
Translation: 5 Him, whom while yet in embryo the hostile, both skilled and fain to harm, may never injure,

Sanskit Text: अन्धा अपश्या न दभन्नभिख्या नित्यास ईं परेतारो अरक्षन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: andhā apaśyā na dabhannabhikhyā nityāsa īṃ pretāro arakṣan ||
Translation: Men blind and sightless through his splendour hurt not: his never-failing lovers have preserved him.

Sanskit Text: महः स राय एषते पतिर्दन्निन इनस्य वसुनः पद आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahaḥ sa rāya eṣate patirdannina inasya vasunaḥ pada ā |
Translation: 1. HITHER he hastens to give, Lord of great riches, King of the mighty, to the place of treasure.

Sanskit Text: उप धरजन्तमद्रयो विधन्नित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa dhrajantamadrayo vidhannit ||
Translation: The pressing-stones shall serve him speeding near us.

Sanskit Text: स यो वर्षा नरां न रोदस्योः शरवोभिरस्ति जीवपीतसर्गः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa yo vṛṣā narāṃ na rodasyoḥ śravobhirasti jīvapītasarghaḥ |
Translation: 2 As Steer of men so Steer of earth and heaven by glory, he whose streams all life hath drunken,

Sanskit Text: पर यः सस्राणः शिश्रीत योनौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yaḥ sasrāṇaḥ śiśrīta yonau ||
Translation: Who hasting forward rests upon the altar.

Sanskit Text: आ यः पुरं नार्मिणीमदीदेदत्यः कविर्नभन्यो नार्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yaḥ puraṃ nārmiṇīmadīdedatyaḥ kavirnabhanyo nārva |
Translation: 3 He who hath lighted up the joyous castle, wise Courser like the Steed of cloudy heaven,

Sanskit Text: सूरो न रुरुक्वाञ्छतात्मा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūro na rurukvāñchatātmā ||
Translation: Bright like the Sun, with hundredfold existence.

Sanskit Text: अभि दविजन्मा तरी रोचनानि विश्व रजांसि शुशुचनो अस्थात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi dvijanmā trī rocanāni viśva rajāṃsi śuśucano asthāt |
Translation: 4 He, doubly born, hath spread in his effulgence through the three luminous realms, through all the regions,

Sanskit Text: होता यजिष्ठो अपां सधस्थे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotā yajiṣṭho apāṃ sadhasthe ||
Translation: Best sacrificing Priest where waters gather.

Sanskit Text: अयं स होत यो दविजन्मा विश्वा दधे वार्याणि शरवस्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ sa hota yo dvijanmā viśvā dadhe vāryāṇi śravasyā |
Translation: 5 Priest doubly born, he through his love of glory hath in his keeping all things worth the choosing,

Sanskit Text: मर्तो यो अस्मै सुतुको ददाश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: marto yo asmai sutuko dadāśa ||
Translation: The man who brings him gifts hath noble offspring.

Sanskit Text: पुरु तव दाश्वान वोचे.अरिरग्ने तव सविदा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: puru tva dāśvān voce.ariraghne tava svidā |
Translation: 1. AGNI, thy faithful servant I call upon thee with many a gift,

Sanskit Text: तोदस्येव शरण आ महस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: todasyeva śaraṇa ā mahasya ||
Translation: As in the keeping of the great inciting God;

Sanskit Text: वयनिनस्य धनिनः परहोषे चिदररुषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyaninasya dhaninaḥ prahoṣe cidararuṣaḥ |
Translation: 2 Thou who ne’er movest thee to aid the indolent, the godless man,

Sanskit Text: कदा चन परजिगतो अदेवयोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadā cana prajighato adevayoḥ ||
Translation: Him who though wealthy never brings an offering.

Sanskit Text: स चन्द्रो विप्र मर्त्यो महो वराधन्तमो दिवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa candro vipra martyo maho vrādhantamo divi |
Translation: 3 Splendid, O Singer, is that man, mightiest of the great in heaven.

Sanskit Text: पर-परेत ते अग्ने वनुषः सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra-pret te aghne vanuṣaḥ syāma ||
Translation: Agni, may we be foremost, we thy worshippers.

Sanskit Text: मित्रं न यं शिम्या गोषु गव्यवः सवाध्यो विदथे अप्सुजीजनन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitraṃ na yaṃ śimyā ghoṣu ghavyavaḥ svādhyo vidathe apsujījanan |
Translation: 1. HEAVEN and earth trembled at the might and voice of him, whom, loved and Holy One, helper of all mankind,

Sanskit Text: अरेजेतां रोदसी पाजसा गिरा परति परियं यजतं जनुषमवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arejetāṃ rodasī pājasā ghirā prati priyaṃ yajataṃ januṣamavaḥ ||
Translation: The wise who longed for spoil in fight for kine brought forth with power, a Friend, mid waters, at the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: यद ध तयद वां पुरुमीळ्हस्य सोमिनः पर मित्रासो न दधिरे सवाभुवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad dha tyad vāṃ purumīḷhasya sominaḥ pra mitrāso na dadhire svābhuvaḥ |
Translation: 2 As these, like friends, have done this work for you, these prompt servants of Purumīlha Soma-offerer,

Sanskit Text: अध करतुं विदतं गतुमर्चत उत शरुतं वर्षणा पस्त्यावतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha kratuṃ vidataṃ ghatumarcata uta śrutaṃ vṛṣaṇā pastyāvataḥ ||
Translation: Give mental power to him who sings the sacred song, and hearken, Strong Ones, to the master of the house.

Sanskit Text: आ वां भूषन कषितयो जन्म रोदस्योः परवाच्यं वर्षणा दक्षसे महे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ bhūṣan kṣitayo janma rodasyoḥ pravācyaṃ vṛṣaṇā dakṣase mahe |
Translation: 3 The folk have glorified your birth from Earth and Heaven, to be extolled, ye Strong Ones, for your mighty power.

Sanskit Text: यदीं रताय भरथो यदर्वते पर होत्रया शिम्य वीथो अध्वरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadīṃ ṛtāya bharatho yadarvate pra hotrayā śimya vītho adhvaram ||
Translation: Ye, when ye bring to singer and the rite, enjoy the sacrifice performed with holy praise and strength.

Sanskit Text: पर सा कषितिरसुर या महि परिय रतावानाव रतमा घोषथो बर्हत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sā kṣitirasura yā mahi priya ṛtāvānāv ṛtamā ghoṣatho bṛhat |
Translation: 4 The people prospers, Asuras! whom ye dearly love: ye, Righteous Ones, proclaim aloud the Holy Law.

Sanskit Text: युवं दिवो बर्हतो दक्षमभुवं गां न धुर्युप युञ्जाथे अपः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ divo bṛhato dakṣamabhuvaṃ ghāṃ na dhuryupa yuñjāthe apaḥ ||
Translation: That efficacious power that comes from lofty heaven, ye bind unto the work, as to the pole an ox.

Sanskit Text: मही अत्र महिना वारं रण्वथो.अरेणवस्तुज आ सद्मन धेनवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahī atra mahinā vāraṃ ṛṇvatho.areṇavastuja ā sadman dhenavaḥ |
Translation: 5 On this great earth ye send your treasure down with might: unstained by dust, the crowding kine are in the stalls.

Sanskit Text: सवरन्ति ता उपरताति सूर्यमा निम्रुच उषसस्तक्ववीरिव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svaranti tā uparatāti sūryamā nimruca uṣasastakvavīriva ||
Translation: Here in the neighbourhood they cry unto the Sun at morning and at evening, like swift birds of prey.

Sanskit Text: आ वं रताय केशिनीरनुषत मित्र यत्र वरुण गातुमर्चथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vaṃ ṛtāya keśinīranuṣata mitra yatra varuṇa ghātumarcathaḥ |
Translation: 6 The flames with curling tresses serve your sacrifice, whereto ye sing the song, Mitra and Varuṇa.

Sanskit Text: अव तमन सर्जतं पिन्वतं धियो युवं विप्रस्य मन्मनमिरज्यथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava tmana sṛjataṃ pinvataṃ dhiyo yuvaṃ viprasya manmanamirajyathaḥ ||
Translation: Send down of your free will, prosper our holy songs: ye are sole Masters of the singer's hymn of praise.

Sanskit Text: यो वां यज्ञैः शशमानो ह दाशति कविर्होता यजति मन्मसाधनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vāṃ yajñaiḥ śaśamāno ha dāśati kavirhotā yajati manmasādhanaḥ |
Translation: 7 Whoso with sacrifices toiling brings you gifts, and worships, sage and priest, fulfilling your desire,—

Sanskit Text: उपाह तं गछथो वीथो अध्वरमछा गिरः सुमतिं गन्तमस्मयु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upāha taṃ ghachatho vītho adhvaramachā ghiraḥ sumatiṃ ghantamasmayu ||
Translation: To him do ye draw nigh and taste his sacrifice. Come well-inclined to us unto our songs and prayer.

Sanskit Text: युवां यज्ञैः परथमा गोभिरञ्जत रतावना मनसो नप्रयुक्तिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvāṃ yajñaiḥ prathamā ghobhirañjata ṛtāvanā manaso naprayuktiṣu |
Translation: 8 With sacrifices and with milk they deck you first, ye Righteous Ones, as if through stirrings of the mind.

Sanskit Text: भरन्ति वां मन्मना संयता गिरो.अद्र्प्यता मनस रेवदशाथे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharanti vāṃ manmanā saṃyatā ghiro.adṛpyatā manasa revadaśāthe ||
Translation: To you they bring their hymns with their collected thought, while ye with earnest soul come to us gloriously.

Sanskit Text: रेवद वयो दधाथे रेवदाशथे नरा मयाभिरितौति महिनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: revad vayo dadhāthe revadāśathe narā mayābhiritauti mahinam |
Translation: 9 Rich strength of life is yours: ye, Heroes, have obtained through your surpassing powers rich far-extending might.

Sanskit Text: न वं दयावो.अहभिर्नोत सिन्धवो न देवत्वं पणयो नानशुर्मघम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na vaṃ dyāvo.ahabhirnota sindhavo na devatvaṃ paṇayo nānaśurmagham ||
Translation: Not the past days conjoined with nights, not rivers, not the Paṇis have attained your Godhead and your wealth.

Sanskit Text: युवं वस्त्रणि पुवसा वसाथे युवोरछिद्रा मन्तवो ह सर्गाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ vastraṇi puvasā vasāthe yuvorachidrā mantavo ha sarghāḥ |
Translation: 1. THE robes which ye put on abound with fatness: uninterrupted courses are your counsels.

Sanskit Text: अवातिरतमन्र्तानि विश्व रतेन मित्रावरुणा सचेथे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avātiratamanṛtāni viśva ṛtena mitrāvaruṇā sacethe ||
Translation: All falsehood, Mitra-Varuṇa! ye conquer, and closely cleave unto the Law Eternal.

Sanskit Text: एतच्चन तवो वि चिकेतदेषां सत्यो मन्त्रः कविशस्त रघावान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etaccana tvo vi ciketadeṣāṃ satyo mantraḥ kaviśasta ṛghāvān |
Translation: 2 This might of theirs hath no one comprehended. True is the crushing word the sage hath uttered,

Sanskit Text: तरिरश्रिं हन्ति चतुरश्रिरुग्रो देवनिदो ह परथमाजूर्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: triraśriṃ hanti caturaśrirughro devanido ha prathamāajūryan ||
Translation: The fearful four-edged bolt smites down the three-edged, and those who hate the Gods first fall and perish.

Sanskit Text: अपादेति परथमा पद्वतीनां कस्तद वां मित्रावरुणा चिकेत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apādeti prathamā padvatīnāṃ kastad vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā ciketa |
Translation: 3 The Footless Maid precedeth footed creatures. Who marketh, Mitra-Varuṇa, this your doing?

Sanskit Text: गर्भो भारं भरत्या चिदस्य रतं पिपर्त्यन्र्तं नि तारीत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: gharbho bhāraṃ bharatyā cidasya ṛtaṃ pipartyanṛtaṃ ni tārīt ||
Translation: The Babe Unborn supporteth this world's burthen, fulfilleth Law and overcometh falsehood.

Sanskit Text: परयन्तमित परि जारं कनीनां पश्यामसि नोपनिपद्यमानम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prayantamit pari jāraṃ kanīnāṃ paśyāmasi nopanipadyamānam |
Translation: 4 We look on him the darling of the Maidens, always advancing, never falling downward,

Sanskit Text: अनवप्र्ग्णा वितता वसानं परियं मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anavapṛghṇā vitatā vasānaṃ priyaṃ mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma ||
Translation: Wearing inseparable, wide-spread raiment, Mitra's and Varuṇa's delightful glory.

Sanskit Text: अनश्वो जातो अनभीशुरर्वा कनिक्रदत पतयदूर्ध्वसानुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anaśvo jāto anabhīśurarvā kanikradat patayadūrdhvasānuḥ |
Translation: 5 Unbridled Courser, born but not of horses, neighing he flieth on with back uplifted.

Sanskit Text: अचित्तं बरह्म जुजुषुर्युवानः पर मित्रे धाम वरुणेग्र्णन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: acittaṃ brahma jujuṣuryuvānaḥ pra mitre dhāma varuṇeghṛṇantaḥ ||
Translation: The youthful love mystery thought-surpassing, praising in Mitra-Varuṇa, its glory.

Sanskit Text: आ धेनवो मामतेयमवन्तीर्ब्रह्मप्रियं पीपयन सस्मिन्नूधन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā dhenavo māmateyamavantīrbrahmapriyaṃ pīpayan sasminnūdhan |
Translation: 6 May the milch-kine who favour Māmateya prosper in this world him who loves devotion.

Sanskit Text: पित्वो भिक्षेत वयुनानि विद्वानासाविवासन्नदितिमुरुष्येत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pitvo bhikṣeta vayunāni vidvānāsāvivāsannaditimuruṣyet ||
Translation: May he, well skilled in rites, be food, and calling Aditi with his lips give us assistance.

Sanskit Text: आ वां मित्रावरुणा हव्यजुष्टिं नमसा देवाववसा वव्र्त्याम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā havyajuṣṭiṃ namasā devāvavasā vavṛtyām |
Translation: 7 Gods, Mitra-Varuṇa, with love and worship, let me make you delight in this oblation.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकं बरह्म पर्तनासु सह्या अस्माकं वर्ष्टिर्दिव्यासुपारा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākaṃ brahma pṛtanāsu sahyā asmākaṃ vṛṣṭirdivyāsupārā ||
Translation: May our prayer be victorious in battles, may we have rain from heaven to make us prosper.

Sanskit Text: यजामहे वां महः सजोषा हव्येभिर्मित्रावरुणा नमोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajāmahe vāṃ mahaḥ sajoṣā havyebhirmitrāvaruṇā namobhiḥ |
Translation: 1. WE worship with our reverence and oblations you, Mitra Varuṇa, accordant, mighty,

Sanskit Text: घर्तैर्घ्र्तस्नू अध यद वामस्मे अध्वर्यवो न धीतिभिर्भरन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtairghṛtasnū adha yad vāmasme adhvaryavo na dhītibhirbharanti ||
Translation: So that with us, ye Twain whose backs are sprinkled with oil, the priests with oil and hymns support you.

Sanskit Text: परस्तुतिर्वां धाम न परयुक्तिरयामि मित्रावरुणा सुव्र्क्तिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prastutirvāṃ dhāma na prayuktirayāmi mitrāvaruṇā suvṛktiḥ |
Translation: 2 Your praise is like a mighty power, an impulse: to you, Twain Gods, a well-formed hymn is offered,

Sanskit Text: अनक्ति यद वां विदथेषु होता सुम्नं वां सूरिर्व्र्षणावियक्षन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anakti yad vāṃ vidatheṣu hotā sumnaṃ vāṃ sūrirvṛṣaṇāviyakṣan ||
Translation: As the priest decks yon, Strong Ones, in assemblies, and the prince fain to worship you for blessings.

Sanskit Text: पीपाय धेनुरदितिर्र्ताय जनाय मित्रावरुणा हविर्दे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pīpāya dhenuraditirṛtāya janāya mitrāvaruṇā havirde |
Translation: 3 O Mitra-Varuṇa, Aditi the Milch-cow streams for the rite, for folk who bring oblation,

Sanskit Text: हिनोति यद वां विदथे सपर्यन स रातहव्यो मानुषो न होता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hinoti yad vāṃ vidathe saparyan sa rātahavyo mānuṣo na hotā ||
Translation: When in the assembly he who worships moves you, like to a human priest, with gifts presented.

Sanskit Text: उत वां विक्षु मद्यास्वन्धो गाव आपश्च पीपयन्त देवीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta vāṃ vikṣu madyāsvandho ghāva āpaśca pīpayanta devīḥ |
Translation: 4 So may the kine and heavenly Waters pour you sweet drink in families that make you joyful.

Sanskit Text: उतो नो अस्य पूर्व्यः पतिर्दन वीतं पातं पयस उस्रियायाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto no asya pūrvyaḥ patirdan vītaṃ pātaṃ payasa usriyāyāḥ ||
Translation: Of this may he, the ancient House-Lord, give us. Enjoy, drink of the milk the cow provideth.

Sanskit Text: विष्णोर्नु कं वीर्याणि पर वोचं यः पार्थिवानि विममेरजांसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viṣṇornu kaṃ vīryāṇi pra vocaṃ yaḥ pārthivāni vimamerajāṃsi |
Translation: 1. I WILL declare the mighty deeds of Viṣṇu, of him who measured out the earthly regions,

Sanskit Text: यो अस्कभायदुत्तरं सधस्थं विचक्रमाणस्त्रेधोरुगायः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo askabhāyaduttaraṃ sadhasthaṃ vicakramāṇastredhorughāyaḥ ||
Translation: Who propped the highest place of congregation, thrice setting down his footstep, widely striding.

Sanskit Text: पर तद विष्णु सतवते वीर्येण मर्गो न भीमः कुचरो गिरिष्ठाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra tad viṣṇu stavate vīryeṇa mṛgho na bhīmaḥ kucaro ghiriṣṭhāḥ |
Translation: 2 For this his mighty deed is Viṣṇu lauded, like some wild beast, dread, prowling, mountain-roaming;

Sanskit Text: यस्योरुषु तरिषु विक्रमणेष्वधिक्षियन्ति भुवनानि विश्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasyoruṣu triṣu vikramaṇeṣvadhikṣiyanti bhuvanāni viśvā ||
Translation: He within whose three wide-extended paces all living creatures have their habitation.

Sanskit Text: पर विष्णवे शूषमेतु मन्म गिरिक्षित उरुगायाय वर्ष्णे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra viṣṇave śūṣametu manma ghirikṣita urughāyāya vṛṣṇe |
Translation: 3 Let the hymn lift itself as strength to Viṣṇu, the Bull far-striding, dwelling on the mountains,

Sanskit Text: य इदं दीर्घं परयतं सधस्थमेको विममे तरिभिरित पदेभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya idaṃ dīrghaṃ prayataṃ sadhasthameko vimame tribhirit padebhiḥ ||
Translation: Him who alone with triple step hath measured this common dwelling-place, long, far extended.

Sanskit Text: यस्य तरी पूर्णा मधुना पदान्यक्षीयमाणा सवधयामदन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya trī pūrṇā madhunā padānyakṣīyamāṇā svadhayāmadanti |
Translation: 4 Him whose three places that are filled with sweetness, imperishable, joy as it may list them,

Sanskit Text: य उ तरिधातु पर्तिवीमुत दयामेको दाधार भुवनानि विश्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya u tridhātu pṛtivīmuta dyāmeko dādhāra bhuvanāni viśvā ||
Translation: Who verily alone upholds the threefold, the earth, the heaven, and all living creatures.

Sanskit Text: तदस्य परियमभि पाथो अश्यां नरो यत्र देवयवो मदन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadasya priyamabhi pātho aśyāṃ naro yatra devayavo madanti |
Translation: 5 May I attain to that his well-loved mansion where men devoted to the Gods are happy.

Sanskit Text: उरुक्रमस्य स हि बन्धुरित्था विष्णोः पदे परमे मध्व उत्सः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: urukramasya sa hi bandhuritthā viṣṇoḥ pade parame madhva utsaḥ ||
Translation: For there springs, close akin to the Wide-Strider, the well of meath in Viṣṇu's highest footstep.

Sanskit Text: ता वं वास्तून्युश्मसि गमध्यै यत्र गावो भूरिश्र्ङगायासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā vaṃ vāstūnyuśmasi ghamadhyai yatra ghāvo bhūriśṛṅghāayāsaḥ |
Translation: 6 Fain would we go unto your dwelling-places where there are many-horned and nimble oxen,

Sanskit Text: अत्राह तदुरुगायस्य वर्ष्णः परमं पदमव भाति भूरि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrāha tadurughāyasya vṛṣṇaḥ paramaṃ padamava bhāti bhūri ||
Translation: For mightily, there, shineth down upon us the widely-striding Bull's sublimest mansion.

Sanskit Text: पर वः पान्तमन्धसो धियायते महे शूराय विष्णवे चार्चत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vaḥ pāntamandhaso dhiyāyate mahe śūrāya viṣṇave cārcata |
Translation: 1. To the great Hero, him who sets his mind thereon, and Viṣṇu, praise aloud in song your draught of juice,—

Sanskit Text: या सानुनि पर्वतानामदाभ्या महस्तस्थतुरर्वतेव साधुना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā sānuni parvatānāmadābhyā mahastasthaturarvateva sādhunā ||
Translation: Gods ne’er beguiled, who borne as ’twere by noble steed, have stood upon the lofty ridges of the hills.

Sanskit Text: तवेषमित्था समरणं शिमीवतोरिन्द्राविष्णू सुतपा वामुरुष्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tveṣamitthā samaraṇaṃ śimīvatorindrāviṣṇū sutapā vāmuruṣyati |
Translation: 2 Your Soma-drinker keeps afar your furious rush, Indra and Viṣṇu, when ye come with all your might.

Sanskit Text: या मर्त्याय परतिधीयमानमित कर्शानोरस्तुरसनामुरुष्यथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā martyāya pratidhīyamānamit kṛśānorasturasanāmuruṣyathaḥ ||
Translation: That which hath been directed well at mortal man, bow-armed Kṛśānu's arrow, ye turn far aside.

Sanskit Text: ता ईं वर्धन्ति मह्यस्य पौंस्यं नि मातरा नयति रेतसे भुजे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā īṃ vardhanti mahyasya pauṃsyaṃ ni mātarā nayati retase bhuje |
Translation: 3 These offerings increase his mighty manly strength: he brings both Parents down to share the genial flow.

Sanskit Text: दधाति पुत्रो.अवरं परं पितुर्नाम तर्तीयमधि रोचने दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhāti putro.avaraṃ paraṃ piturnāma tṛtīyamadhi rocane divaḥ ||
Translation: He lowers, though a son, the Father's highest name; the third is that which is high in the light of heaven.

Sanskit Text: तत-तदिदस्य पौंस्यं गर्णीमसीनस्य तरतुरव्र्कस्य मीळ्हुषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat-tadidasya pauṃsyaṃ ghṛṇīmasīnasya traturavṛkasya mīḷhuṣaḥ |
Translation: 4 We laud this manly power of him the Mighty One, preserver, inoffensive, bounteous and benign;

Sanskit Text: यः पार्थिवानि तरिभिरिद विगामभिरुरु करमिष्टोरुगायाय जीवसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ pārthivāni tribhirid vighāmabhiruru kramiṣṭorughāyāya jīvase ||
Translation: His who strode, widely pacing, with three steppings forth over the realms of earth for freedom and for life.

Sanskit Text: दवे इदस्य करमणे सवर्द्र्शो.अभिख्याय मर्त्यो भुरण्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dve idasya kramaṇe svardṛśo.abhikhyāya martyo bhuraṇyati |
Translation: 5 A mortal man, when he beholds two steps of him who looks upon the light, is restless with amaze.

Sanskit Text: तर्तीयमस्य नकिरा दधर्षति वयश्चन पतयन्तः पतत्रिणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tṛtīyamasya nakirā dadharṣati vayaścana patayantaḥ patatriṇaḥ ||
Translation: But his third step doth no one venture to approach, no, nor the feathered birds of air who fly with wings.

Sanskit Text: चतुर्भिः साकं नवतिं च नामभिश्चक्रं न वर्त्तं वयतीन्रवीविपत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: caturbhiḥ sākaṃ navatiṃ ca nāmabhiścakraṃ na vṛttaṃ vyatīnravīvipat |
Translation: 6 He, like a rounded wheel, hath in swift motion set his ninety racing steeds together with the four.

Sanskit Text: बर्हच्छरीरो विमिमान रक्वभिर्युवाकुमारः परत्येत्याहवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaccharīro vimimāna ṛkvabhiryuvākumāraḥ pratyetyāhavam ||
Translation: Developed, vast in form, with those who sing forth praise, a youth, no more a child, he cometh to our call.

Sanskit Text: भवा मित्रो न शेव्यो घर्तासुतिर्विभूतद्युम्न एवया उ सप्रथाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhavā mitro na śevyo ghṛtāsutirvibhūtadyumna evayā u saprathāḥ |
Translation: 1. FAR-SHINING, widely famed, going thy wonted way, fed with the oil, be helpful. Mitra-like, to us.

Sanskit Text: अधा ते विष्णो विदुषा चिदर्ध्य सतोमो यज्ञश्चराध्यो हविष्मता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā te viṣṇo viduṣā cidardhya stomo yajñaścarādhyo haviṣmatā ||
Translation: So, Viṣṇu, e’en the wise must swell thy song of praise, and he who hath oblations pay thee solemn rites.

Sanskit Text: यः पूर्व्याय वेधसे नवीयसे सुमज्जानये विष्णवे ददाशति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ pūrvyāya vedhase navīyase sumajjānaye viṣṇave dadāśati |
Translation: 2 He who brings gifts to him the Ancient and the Last, to Viṣṇu who ordains, together with his Spouse,

Sanskit Text: यो जातमस्य महतो महि बरवत सेदु शरवोभिर्युज्यं चिदभ्यसत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo jātamasya mahato mahi bravat sedu śravobhiryujyaṃ cidabhyasat ||
Translation: Who tells the lofty birth of him the Lofty One, shall verily surpass in glory e’en his peer.

Sanskit Text: तमु सतोतारः पूर्व्यं यथा विद रतस्य गर्भं जनुषापिपर्तन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamu stotāraḥ pūrvyaṃ yathā vida ṛtasya gharbhaṃ januṣāpipartana |
Translation: 3 Him have ye satisfied, singers, as well as ye know, primeval germ of Order even from his birth.

Sanskit Text: आस्य जानन्तो नाम चिद विवक्तन महस्ते विष्णो सुमतिं भजामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsya jānanto nāma cid vivaktana mahaste viṣṇo sumatiṃ bhajāmahe ||
Translation: Ye, knowing e’en his name, have told it forth: may we, Viṣṇu, enjoy the grace of thee the Mighty One.

Sanskit Text: तमस्य राजा वरुणस्तमश्विना करतुं सचन्त मारुतस्य वेधसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamasya rājā varuṇastamaśvinā kratuṃ sacanta mārutasya vedhasaḥ |
Translation: 4 The Sovran Varuṇa and both the Aśvins wait on this the will of him who guides the Marut host.

Sanskit Text: दाधार दक्षमुत्तममहर्विदं वरजं च विष्णुः सखिवानपोर्णुते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dādhāra dakṣamuttamamaharvidaṃ vrajaṃ ca viṣṇuḥ sakhivānaporṇute ||
Translation: Viṣṇu hath power supreme and might that finds the day, and with his Friend unbars the stable of the kine.

Sanskit Text: आ यो विवाय सचथाय दैव्य इन्द्राय विष्णुः सुक्र्ते सुक्र्त्तरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yo vivāya sacathāya daivya indrāya viṣṇuḥ sukṛte sukṛttaraḥ |
Translation: 5 Even he the Heavenly One who came for fellowship, Viṣṇu to Indra, godly to the godlier,

Sanskit Text: वेधा अजिन्वत तरिषधस्थ आर्यं रतस्य भागे यजमानमाभजत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vedhā ajinvat triṣadhastha āryaṃ ṛtasya bhāghe yajamānamābhajat ||
Translation: Who Maker, throned in three worlds, helps the Āryan man, and gives the worshipper his share of Holy Law.

Sanskit Text: अबोध्यग्निर्ज्म उदेति सूर्यो वयुषाश्चन्द्रा मह्यावो अर्चिषा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abodhyaghnirjma udeti sūryo vyuṣāścandrā mahyāvo arciṣā |
Translation: 1. AGNI is wakened: Sūrya riseth from the earth. Mighty, refulgent Dawn hath shone with all her light.

Sanskit Text: आयुक्षातामश्विना यातवे रथं परासावीद देवः सविता जगत पर्थक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āyukṣātāmaśvinā yātave rathaṃ prāsāvīd devaḥ savitā jaghat pṛthak ||
Translation: The Aśvins have equipped their chariot for the course. God Savitar hath moved the folk in sundry ways.

Sanskit Text: यद युञ्जाथे वर्षणमश्विना रथं घर्तेन नो मधुना कषत्रमुक्षतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad yuñjāthe vṛṣaṇamaśvinā rathaṃ ghṛtena no madhunā kṣatramukṣatam |
Translation: 2 When, Aśvins, ye equip your very mighty car, bedew, ye Twain, our power with honey and with oil.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकं बरह्म पर्तनासु जिन्वतं वयं धना शूरसाता भजेमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākaṃ brahma pṛtanāsu jinvataṃ vayaṃ dhanā śūrasātā bhajemahi ||
Translation: To our devotion give victorious strength in war: may we win riches in the heroes' strife for spoil.

Sanskit Text: अर्वां तरिचक्रो मधुवाहनो रथो जीराश्वो अश्विनोर्यातु सुष्टुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāṃ tricakro madhuvāhano ratho jīrāśvo aśvinoryātu suṣṭutaḥ |
Translation: 3 Nigh to us come the Aśvins' lauded three-wheeled car, the car laden with meath and drawn by fleet-foot steeds,

Sanskit Text: तरिवन्धुरो मघवा विश्वसौभगः शं न आ वक्षद दविपदे चतुष्पदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trivandhuro maghavā viśvasaubhaghaḥ śaṃ na ā vakṣad dvipade catuṣpade ||
Translation: Three-seated, opulent, bestowing all delight. may it bring weal to us, to cattle and to men.

Sanskit Text: आ न ऊर्जं वहतमश्विना युवं मधुमत्या नः कशया मिमिक्षतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā na ūrjaṃ vahatamaśvinā yuvaṃ madhumatyā naḥ kaśayā mimikṣatam |
Translation: 4 Bring hither nourishment for us, ye Aśvins Twain; sprinkle us with your whip that drops with honey-dew.

Sanskit Text: परायुस्तारिष्टं नी रपांसि मर्क्षतं सेधतं दवेषो भवतं सचाभुवा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāyustāriṣṭaṃ nī rapāṃsi mṛkṣataṃ sedhataṃ dveṣo bhavataṃ sacābhuvā ||
Translation: Prolong our days of life, wipe out our trespasses; destroy our foes, be our companions and our Friends.

Sanskit Text: युवं ह गर्भं जगतीषु धत्थो युवं विश्वेषु भुवनेष्वन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ ha gharbhaṃ jaghatīṣu dhattho yuvaṃ viśveṣu bhuvaneṣvantaḥ |
Translation: 5 Ye store the germ of life in female creatures, ye lay it up within all living beings.

Sanskit Text: युवमग्निं च वर्षणावपश्च वनस्पतीन्रश्विनावैरयेथाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvamaghniṃ ca vṛṣaṇāvapaśca vanaspatīnraśvināvairayethām ||
Translation: Ye have sent forth, O Aśvins passing mighty, the fire, the sovrans of the wood, the waters,

Sanskit Text: युवं ह सथो भिषजा भेषजेभिरथो ह सथो रथ्या राथ्येभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ ha stho bhiṣajā bheṣajebhiratho ha stho rathyā rāthyebhiḥ |
Translation: 6 Leeches are ye with medicines to heal us, and charioteers are ye with skill in driving.

Sanskit Text: अथो ह कषत्रमधि धत्थ उग्रा यो वां हविष्मान्मनसा ददाश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atho ha kṣatramadhi dhattha ughrā yo vāṃ haviṣmānmanasā dadāśa ||
Translation: Ye Strong, give sway to him who brings oblation and with his heart pours out his gift before you.

Sanskit Text: वसू रुद्रा पुरुमन्तू वर्धन्ता दशस्यतं नो वर्षणावभिष्टौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasū rudrā purumantū vṛdhantā daśasyataṃ no vṛṣaṇāvabhiṣṭau |
Translation: 1. YE Vasus Twain, ye Rudras full of counsel, grant us, Strong Strengtheners, when ye stand beside us,

Sanskit Text: दस्रा ह यद रेक्ण औचथ्यो वां पर यत सस्राथेकवाभिरूती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dasrā ha yad rekṇa aucathyo vāṃ pra yat sasrātheakavābhirūtī ||
Translation: What wealth Aucathya craves of you, great Helpers when ye come forward with no niggard succour.

Sanskit Text: को वां दाशत सुमतये चिदस्यै वसू यद धेथे नमसा पदे गोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko vāṃ dāśat sumataye cidasyai vasū yad dhethe namasā pade ghoḥ |
Translation: 2 Who may give you aught, Vasus, for your favour, for what, at the Cow's place, ye grant through worship?

Sanskit Text: जिग्र्तमस्मे रेवतीः पुरन्धीः कामप्रेणेव मनसा चरन्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jighṛtamasme revatīḥ purandhīḥ kāmapreṇeva manasā carantā ||
Translation: Wake for us understanding full of riches, come with a heart that will fulfil our longing.

Sanskit Text: युक्तो ह यद वां तौग्र्याय पेरुर्वि मध्ये अर्णसो धायि पज्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yukto ha yad vāṃ taughryāya perurvi madhye arṇaso dhāyi pajraḥ |
Translation: 3 As erst for Tugra's son your car, sea-crossing, strong, was equipped and set amid the waters,

Sanskit Text: उप वामवः शरणं गमेयं शूरो नाज्म पतयद्भिरेवैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa vāmavaḥ śaraṇaṃ ghameyaṃ śūro nājma patayadbhirevaiḥ ||
Translation: So may I gain your shelter and protection as with winged course a hero seeks his army.

Sanskit Text: उपस्तुतिरौचथ्यमुरुष्येन मा मामिमे पतत्रिणी वि दुग्धाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upastutiraucathyamuruṣyen mā māmime patatriṇī vi dughdhām |
Translation: 4 May this my praise preserve Ucathya's offspring: let not these Twain who fly with wings exhaust me.

Sanskit Text: मा मामेधो दशतयश्चितो धाक पर यद वां बद्धस्त्मनि खादति कषाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā māmedho daśatayaścito dhāk pra yad vāṃ baddhastmani khādati kṣām ||
Translation: Let not the wood ten times up-piled consume me, when fixed for you it bites the ground it stands on.

Sanskit Text: न मा गरन नद्यो मात्र्तमा दासा यदीं सुसमुब्धमवाधुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na mā gharan nadyo mātṛtamā dāsā yadīṃ susamubdhamavādhuḥ |
Translation: 5 The most maternal streams, wherein the Dāsas cast me securely bound, have not devoured me.

Sanskit Text: शिरो यदस्य तरैतनो वितक्षत सवयं दास उरो अंसावपि गध ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śiro yadasya traitano vitakṣat svayaṃ dāsa uro aṃsāvapi ghdha ||
Translation: When Traitana would cleave my head asunder, the Dāsa wounded his own breast and shoulders.

Sanskit Text: दीर्घतमा मामतेयो जुजुर्वान दशमे युगे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dīrghatamā māmateyo jujurvān daśame yughe |
Translation: 6 Dīrghatamas the son of Mamatā hath come to length of days in the tenth age of human kind.

Sanskit Text: अपामर्थं यतीनां बरह्मा भवति सारथिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāmarthaṃ yatīnāṃ brahmā bhavati sārathiḥ ||
Translation: He is the Brahman of the waters as they strive to reach their end and aim: their charioteer is he.

Sanskit Text: पर दयावा यज्ञैः पर्थिवी रताव्र्धा मही सतुषे विदथेषु परचेतसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra dyāvā yajñaiḥ pṛthivī ṛtāvṛdhā mahī stuṣe vidatheṣu pracetasā |
Translation: 1. I PRAISE with sacrifices mighty Heaven and Earth at festivals, the wise, the Strengtheners of Law.

Sanskit Text: देवेभिर्ये देवपुत्रे सुदंससेत्था धिया वार्याणि परभूषतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devebhirye devaputre sudaṃsasetthā dhiyā vāryāṇi prabhūṣataḥ ||
Translation: Who, having Gods for progeny, conjoined with Gods, through wonder-working wisdom bring forth choicest boons.

Sanskit Text: उत मन्ये पितुरद्रुहो मनो मातुर्महि सवतवस्तद धवीमभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta manye pituradruho mano māturmahi svatavastad dhavīmabhiḥ |
Translation: 2 With invocations, on the gracious Father's mind, and on the Mother's great inherent power I muse.

Sanskit Text: सुरेतसा पितरा भूम चक्रतुरुरु परजाया अम्र्तंवरीमभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suretasā pitarā bhūma cakratururu prajāyā amṛtaṃvarīmabhiḥ ||
Translation: Prolific Parents, they have made the world of life, and for their brood all round wide immortality.

Sanskit Text: ते सूनवः सवपसः सुदंससो मही जज्ञुर्मातरा पूर्वचित्तये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te sūnavaḥ svapasaḥ sudaṃsaso mahī jajñurmātarā pūrvacittaye |
Translation: 3 These Sons of yours well skilled in work, of wondrous power, brought forth to life the two great Mothers first of all.

Sanskit Text: सथातुश्च सत्यं जगतश्च धर्मणि पुत्रस्य पाथः पदमद्वयाविनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sthātuśca satyaṃ jaghataśca dharmaṇi putrasya pāthaḥ padamadvayāvinaḥ ||
Translation: To keep the truth of all that stands and all that moves, ye guard the station of your Son who knows no guile.

Sanskit Text: ते मायिनो ममिरे सुप्रचेतसो जामी सयोनी मिथुना समोकसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te māyino mamire supracetaso jāmī sayonī mithunā samokasā |
Translation: 4 They with surpassing skill, most wise, have measured out the Twins united in their birth and in their home.

Sanskit Text: नव्यं-नव्यं तन्तुमा तन्वते दिवि समुद्रे अन्तः कवयः सुदीतयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: navyaṃ-navyaṃ tantumā tanvate divi samudre antaḥ kavayaḥ sudītayaḥ ||
Translation: They, the refulgent Sages, weave within the sky, yea, in the depths of sea, a web for ever new.

Sanskit Text: तद राधो अद्य सवितुर्वरेण्यं वयं देवस्य परसवे मनामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad rādho adya saviturvareṇyaṃ vayaṃ devasya prasave manāmahe |
Translation: 5 This is to-day the goodliest gift of Savitar: this thought we have when now the God is furthering us.

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं दयावाप्र्थिवी सुचेतुना रयिं धत्तं वसुमन्तं शतग्विनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī sucetunā rayiṃ dhattaṃ vasumantaṃ śataghvinam ||
Translation: On us with loving-kindness Heaven and Earth bestow riches and various wealth and treasure hundredfold!

Sanskit Text: ते हि दयावाप्र्थिवी विश्वशम्भुव रतावरी रजसो धारयत्कवी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī viśvaśambhuva ṛtāvarī rajaso dhārayatkavī |
Translation: 1. THESE, Heaven and Earth, bestow prosperity on all, sustainers of the region, Holy Ones and wise,

Sanskit Text: सुजन्मनी धिषणे अन्तरीयते देवो देवी धर्मणा सूर्यः शुचिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sujanmanī dhiṣaṇe antarīyate devo devī dharmaṇā sūryaḥ śuciḥ ||
Translation: Two Bowls of noble kind: between these Goddesses the God, the fulgent Sun, travels by fixed decree.

Sanskit Text: उरुव्यचसा महिनी असश्चता पिता माता च भुवनानि रक्षतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uruvyacasā mahinī asaścatā pitā mātā ca bhuvanāni rakṣataḥ |
Translation: 2 Widely-capacious Pair, mighty, that never fail, the Father and the Mother keep all creatures safe:

Sanskit Text: सुध्र्ष्टमे वपुष्ये न रोदसी पिता यत सीमभि रूपैरवासयत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sudhṛṣṭame vapuṣye na rodasī pitā yat sīmabhi rūpairavāsayat ||
Translation: The two world-halves, the spirited, the beautiful, because the Father hath clothed them in goodly forms.

Sanskit Text: स वह्निः पुत्रः पित्रोः पवित्रवान पुनाति धीरो भुवनानि मायया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vahniḥ putraḥ pitroḥ pavitravān punāti dhīro bhuvanāni māyayā |
Translation: 3 Son of these Parents, he the Priest with power to cleanse, Sage, sanctifies the worlds with his surpassing power.

Sanskit Text: धेनुं च पर्श्निं वर्षभं सुरेतसं विश्वाहा शुक्रं पयो अस्य दुक्षत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhenuṃ ca pṛśniṃ vṛṣabhaṃ suretasaṃ viśvāhā śukraṃ payo asya dukṣata ||
Translation: Thereto for his bright milk he milked through all the days the party-coloured Cow and the prolific Bull.

Sanskit Text: अयं देवानामपसामपस्तमो यो जजान रोदसी विश्वशम्भुवा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ devānāmapasāmapastamo yo jajāna rodasī viśvaśambhuvā |
Translation: 4 Among the skilful Gods most skilled is he, who made the two world-halves which bring prosperity to all;

Sanskit Text: वि यो ममे रजसी सुक्रतूययाजरेभि सकम्भनेभिःसमान्र्चे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yo mame rajasī sukratūyayājarebhi skambhanebhiḥsamānṛce ||
Translation: Who with great wisdom measured both the regions out, and stablished them with pillars that shall ne’er decay.

Sanskit Text: ते नो गर्णाने महिनी महि शरवः कषत्रं दयावाप्र्थिवी धासथो बर्हत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te no ghṛṇāne mahinī mahi śravaḥ kṣatraṃ dyāvāpṛthivī dhāsatho bṛhat |
Translation: 5 Extolled in song, O Heaven and Earth, bestow on us, ye mighty Pair, great glory and high lordly sway,

Sanskit Text: येनाभि कर्ष्टीस्ततनाम विश्वहा पनाय्यमोजो अस्मे समिन्वतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenābhi kṛṣṭīstatanāma viśvahā panāyyamojo asme saminvatam ||
