Translation: Whereby we may extend ourselves ever over the folk; and send us strength that shall deserve the praise of men.

Sanskit Text: किमु शरेष्ठः किं यविष्ठो न आजगन किमीयते दूत्यं कद यदूचिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kimu śreṣṭhaḥ kiṃ yaviṣṭho na ājaghan kimīyate dūtyaṃ kad yadūcima |
Translation: 1 WHY hath the Best, why hath the Youngest come to us? Upon what embassy comes he? What have we said?

Sanskit Text: न निन्दिम चमसं यो महाकुलो.अग्ने भरातर्द्रुण इद भूतिमूदिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na nindima camasaṃ yo mahākulo.aghne bhrātardruṇa id bhūtimūdima ||
Translation: We have not blamed the chalice of illustrious birth. We, Brother Agni, praised the goodness of the wood.

Sanskit Text: एकं चमसं चतुरः कर्णोतन तद वो देवा अब्रुवन तद व आगमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ekaṃ camasaṃ caturaḥ kṛṇotana tad vo devā abruvan tad va āghamam |
Translation: 2 The chalice that is single make ye into four: thus have the Gods commanded; therefore am I come.

Sanskit Text: सौधन्वना यद्येवा करिष्यथ साकं देवैर्यज्ञियासो भविष्यथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saudhanvanā yadyevā kariṣyatha sākaṃ devairyajñiyāso bhaviṣyatha ||
Translation: If, O Sudhanvan's Children, ye will do this thing ye shall participate in sacrifice with Gods.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं दूतं परति यदब्रवीतनाश्वः कर्त्वो रथ उतेह कर्त्वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ dūtaṃ prati yadabravītanāśvaḥ kartvo ratha uteha kartvaḥ |
Translation: 3 What to the envoy Agni in reply ye spake, A courser must be made, a chariot fashioned here,

Sanskit Text: धेनुः कर्त्वा युवशा कर्त्वा दवा तानि भरातरनु वः कर्त्व्येमसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhenuḥ kartvā yuvaśā kartvā dvā tāni bhrātaranu vaḥ kṛtvyemasi ||
Translation: A cow must be created, and the Twain made young. When we have done these things, Brother, we turn to you.

Sanskit Text: चक्र्वांस रभवस्तदप्र्छत कवेदभूद यः सय दूतो न आजगन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakṛvāṃsa ṛbhavastadapṛchata kvedabhūd yaḥ sya dūto na ājaghan |
Translation: 4 When thus, O Ṛbhus, ye had done ye questioned thus, Whither went he who came to us a messenger?

Sanskit Text: यदावाख्यच्चमसाञ्चतुरः कर्तानादित तवष्टा गनास्वन्तर्न्यानजे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadāvākhyaccamasāñcaturaḥ kṛtānādit tvaṣṭā ghnāsvantarnyānaje ||
Translation: Then Tvaṣṭar, when he viewed the four wrought chalices, concealed himself among the Consorts of the Gods.

Sanskit Text: हनामैनानिति तवष्टा यदब्रवीच्चमसं ये देवपानमनिन्दिषुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hanāmaināniti tvaṣṭā yadabravīccamasaṃ ye devapānamanindiṣuḥ |
Translation: 5 As Tvaṣṭar thus had spoken, Let us slay these men who have reviled the chalice, drinking-cup of Gods,

Sanskit Text: अन्या नामानि कर्ण्वते सुते सचानन्यैरेनान्कन्या नामभि सपरत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anyā nāmāni kṛṇvate sute sacānanyairenānkanyā nāmabhi sparat ||
Translation: They gave themselves new names when Soma juice was shed, and under these new names the Maiden welcomed them.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो हरी युयुजे अश्विना रथं बर्हस्पतिर्विश्वरूपामुपाजत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro harī yuyuje aśvinā rathaṃ bṛhaspatirviśvarūpāmupājata |
Translation: 6 Indra hath yoked his Bays, the Aśvins' car is horsed, Bṛhaspati hath brought the Cow of every hue.

Sanskit Text: रभुर्विभ्वा वाजो देवानगछत सवपसो यज्ञियम्भागमैतन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛbhurvibhvā vājo devānaghachata svapaso yajñiyambhāghamaitana ||
Translation: Ye went as Ṛbhus, Vibhvan, Vāja to the Gods, and skilled in war, obtained your share in sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: निश्चर्मणो गामरिणीत धीतिभिर्या जरन्ता युवशा ताक्र्णोतन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: niścarmaṇo ghāmariṇīta dhītibhiryā jarantā yuvaśā tākṛṇotana |
Translation: 7 Ye by your wisdom brought a cow from out a hide; unto that ancient Pair ye gave again their youth.

Sanskit Text: सौधन्वना अश्वादश्वमतक्षत युक्त्वा रथमुप देवानयातन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saudhanvanā aśvādaśvamatakṣata yuktvā rathamupa devānayātana ||
Translation: Out of a horse, Sudhanvan's Sons, ye formed a horse: a chariot ye equipped, and went unto the Gods.

Sanskit Text: इदमुदकं पिबतेत्यब्रवीतनेदं वा घा पिबता मुञ्जनेजनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idamudakaṃ pibatetyabravītanedaṃ vā ghā pibatā muñjanejanam |
Translation: 8 Drink ye this water, were the words ye spake to them; or drink ye this, the rinsing of the Muñja-grass.

Sanskit Text: सौधन्वना यदि तन नेव हर्यथ तर्तीये घ सवने मादयाध्वै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saudhanvanā yadi tan neva haryatha tṛtīye gha savane mādayādhvai ||
Translation: If ye approve not even this, Sudhanvan's Sons, then at the third libation gladden ye yourselves.

Sanskit Text: आपो भूयिष्ठा इत्येको अब्रवीदग्निर्भूयिष्ठ इत्यन्यो अब्रवीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpo bhūyiṣṭhā ityeko abravīdaghnirbhūyiṣṭha ityanyo abravīt |
Translation: 9 Most excellent are waters, thus said one of you; most excellent is Agni, thus another said.

Sanskit Text: वधर्यन्तीं बहुभ्यः परैको अब्रवीद रता वदन्तश्चमसानपिंशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vadharyantīṃ bahubhyaḥ praiko abravīd ṛtā vadantaścamasānapiṃśata ||
Translation: Another praised to many a one the lightning cloud. Then did ye shape the cups, speaking the words of truth.

Sanskit Text: शरोणामेक उदकं गामवजति मांसमेकः पिंशति सूनयाभ्र्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śroṇāmeka udakaṃ ghāmavajati māṃsamekaḥ piṃśati sūnayābhṛtam |
Translation: 10 One downward to the water drives the crippled cow, another trims the flesh brought on the carving-board.

Sanskit Text: आ निम्रुचः शक्र्देको अपभरत किं सवित पुत्रेभ्यः पितरा उपावतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā nimrucaḥ śakṛdeko apabharat kiṃ svit putrebhyaḥ pitarā upāvatuḥ ||
Translation: One carries off the refuse at the set of sun. How did the Parents aid their children in their task!

Sanskit Text: उद्वत्स्वस्मा अक्र्णोतन तर्णं निवत्स्वपः सवपस्यय नरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udvatsvasmā akṛṇotana tṛṇaṃ nivatsvapaḥ svapasyaya naraḥ |
Translation: 11 On the high places ye have made the grass for man, and water in the valleys, by your skill, O Men.

Sanskit Text: अगोह्यस्य यदसस्तना गर्हे तदद्येदं रभवो नानु गछथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghohyasya yadasastanā ghṛhe tadadyedaṃ ṛbhavo nānu ghachatha ||
Translation: Ṛbhus, ye iterate not to-day that act of yours, your sleeping in the house of him whom naught can hide.

Sanskit Text: सम्मील्य यद भुवना पर्यसर्पत कव सवित तात्या पितर वासतुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sammīlya yad bhuvanā paryasarpata kva svit tātyā pitara vāsatuḥ |
Translation: 12 As, compassing them round, ye glided through the worlds, where had the venerable Parents their abode?

Sanskit Text: अशपत यः करस्नं व अददे यः पराब्रवीत परोतस्म अब्रवीतन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśapata yaḥ karasnaṃ va adade yaḥ prābravīt protasma abravītana ||
Translation: Ye laid a curse on him who raised his arm at you: to him who spake aloud to you ye spake again.

Sanskit Text: सुषुप्वांस रभवस्तदप्र्छतागोह्य क इदं नो अबूबुधत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suṣupvāṃsa ṛbhavastadapṛchatāghohya ka idaṃ no abūbudhat |
Translation: 13 When ye had slept your fill, ye Ṛbhus, thus ye asked, O thou whom naught may hide, who now hath wakened us?

Sanskit Text: शवानं बस्तो बोधयितारमब्रवीत सम्वत्सर इदमद्या वयख्यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śvānaṃ basto bodhayitāramabravīt samvatsara idamadyā vyakhyata ||
Translation: The goat declared the hound to be your wakener. That day, in a full year, ye first unclosed our eyes.

Sanskit Text: दिवा यन्ति मरुतो भूम्याग्निरयं वातो अन्तरिक्षेण यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divā yanti maruto bhūmyāghnirayaṃ vāto antarikṣeṇa yati |
Translation: 14 The Maruts move in heaven, on earth this Agni; through the mid-firmament the Wind approaches.

Sanskit Text: अद्भिर्यति वरुणः समुद्रैर्युष्मानिछन्तः शवसो नपातः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adbhiryati varuṇaḥ samudrairyuṣmānichantaḥ śavaso napātaḥ ||
Translation: Varuṇa comes in the sea's gathered waters, O Sons of Strength, desirous of your presence.

Sanskit Text: मा नो मित्रो वरुणो अर्यमायुरिन्द्र रभुक्षा मरुतः परिख्यन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no mitro varuṇo aryamāyurindra ṛbhukṣā marutaḥ parikhyan |
Translation: 1. SLIGHT us not Varuṇa, Aryaman, or Mitra, Ṛbhukṣan, Indra, Āyu, or the Maruts,

Sanskit Text: यद वाजिनो देवजतस्य सप्तेः परवक्ष्यामो विदथे वीर्याणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vājino devajatasya sapteḥ pravakṣyāmo vidathe vīryāṇi ||
Translation: When we declare amid the congregation the virtues of the strong Steed, God-descended.

Sanskit Text: यन निर्णिजा रेक्णसा पराव्र्तस्य रतिं गर्भीतां मुखतो नयन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yan nirṇijā rekṇasā prāvṛtasya ratiṃ ghṛbhītāṃ mukhato nayanti |
Translation: 2 What time they bear before the Courser, covered with trappings and with wealth, the grasped oblation,

Sanskit Text: सुप्रनजो मेम्यद विश्वरूप इन्द्रापूष्णोः परियमप्येति पाथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: supranajo memyad viśvarūpa indrāpūṣṇoḥ priyamapyeti pāthaḥ ||
Translation: The dappled goat goeth straightforward, bleating, to the place dear to Indra and to Pūṣan.

Sanskit Text: एष छागः पुरो अश्वेन वाजिना पूष्णो भागो नीयते विश्वदेव्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa chāghaḥ puro aśvena vājinā pūṣṇo bhāgho nīyate viśvadevyaḥ |
Translation: 3 Dear to all Gods, this goat, the share of Pūṣan, is first led forward with the vigorous Courser,

Sanskit Text: अभिप्रियं यत पुरोळाशमर्वता तवष्टेदेनं सौश्रवसाय जिन्वति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhipriyaṃ yat puroḷāśamarvatā tvaṣṭedenaṃ sauśravasāya jinvati ||
Translation: While Tvaṣṭar sends him forward with the Charger, acceptable for sacrifice, to glory.

Sanskit Text: यद धविष्यं रतुशो देवयानं तरिर्मानुषाः पर्यश्वं नयन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad dhaviṣyaṃ ṛtuśo devayānaṃ trirmānuṣāḥ paryaśvaṃ nayanti |
Translation: 4 When thrice the men lead round the Steed, in order, who goeth to the Gods as meet oblation,

Sanskit Text: अत्रा पूष्णः परथमो भाग एति यज्ञं देवेभ्यः परतिवेदयन्नजः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrā pūṣṇaḥ prathamo bhāgha eti yajñaṃ devebhyaḥ prativedayannajaḥ ||
Translation: The goat precedeth him, the share of Pūṣan, and to the Gods the sacrifice announceth.

Sanskit Text: होताध्वर्युरावया अग्निमिन्धो गरावग्राभ उत शंस्ता सुविप्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotādhvaryurāvayā aghnimindho ghrāvaghrābha uta śaṃstā suvipraḥ |
Translation: 5 Invoker, ministering priest, atoner, fire-kindler Soma-presser, sage, reciter,

Sanskit Text: तेन यज्ञेन सवरंक्र्तेन सविष्टेन वक्षणा आप्र्णध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tena yajñena svaraṃkṛtena sviṣṭena vakṣaṇā āpṛṇadhvam ||
Translation: With this well ordered sacrifice, well finished, do ye fill full the channels of the rivers.

Sanskit Text: यूपव्रस्का उत ये यूपवाहाश्चषालं ये अश्वयूपाय तक्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūpavraskā uta ye yūpavāhāścaṣālaṃ ye aśvayūpāya takṣati |
Translation: 6 The hewers of the post and those who carry it, and those who carve the knob to deck the Horse's stake;

Sanskit Text: ये चार्वते पचनं सम्भरन्त्युतो तेषामभिगूर्तिर्न इन्वतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye cārvate pacanaṃ sambharantyuto teṣāmabhighūrtirna invatu ||
Translation: Those who prepare the cooking-vessels for the Steed,—may the approving help of these promote our work.

Sanskit Text: उप परागात सुमन मे.अधायि मन्म देवानामाशा उप वीतप्र्ष्ठः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa prāghāt suman me.adhāyi manma devānāmāśā upa vītapṛṣṭhaḥ |
Translation: 7 Forth, for the regions of the Gods, the Charger with his smooth back is come my prayer attends him.

Sanskit Text: अन्वेनं विप्रा रषयो मदन्ति देवानां पुष्टे चक्र्मा सुबन्धुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anvenaṃ viprā ṛṣayo madanti devānāṃ puṣṭe cakṛmā subandhum ||
Translation: In him rejoice the singers and the sages. A good friend have we won for the Gods’ banquet.

Sanskit Text: यद वाजिनो दाम सुन्दानमर्वतो या शीर्षण्या रशनारज्जुरस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vājino dāma sundānamarvato yā śīrṣaṇyā raśanārajjurasya |
Translation: 8 May the fleet Courser's halter and his heel-ropes, the head-stall and the girths and cords about him.

Sanskit Text: यद वा घास्य परभ्र्तमास्ये तर्णं सर्वा ता ते अपि देवेष्वस्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā ghāsya prabhṛtamāsye tṛṇaṃ sarvā tā te api deveṣvastu ||
Translation: And the grass put within his mouth to bait him,—among the Gods, too, let all these be with thee.

Sanskit Text: यदश्वस्य करविषो मक्षिकाश यद वा सवरौ सवधितौ रिप्तमस्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadaśvasya kraviṣo makṣikāśa yad vā svarau svadhitau riptamasti |
Translation: 9 What part of the Steed's flesh the fly hath eaten, or is left sticking to the post or hatchet,

Sanskit Text: यद धस्तयोः शमितुर्यन नखेषु सर्वा ता ते अपि देवेष्वस्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad dhastayoḥ śamituryan nakheṣu sarvā tā te api deveṣvastu ||
Translation: Or to the slayer's hands and nails adhereth,—among the Gods, too, may all this be with thee.

Sanskit Text: यदूवध्यमुदरस्यापवाति य आमस्य करविषो गन्धो अस्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadūvadhyamudarasyāpavāti ya āmasya kraviṣo ghandho asti |
Translation: 10 Food undigested steaming from his belly, and any odour of raw flesh remaining,

Sanskit Text: सुक्र्ता तच्छमितारः कर्ण्वन्तूत मेधं शर्तपाकं पचन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sukṛtā tacchamitāraḥ kṛṇvantūta medhaṃ śṛtapākaṃ pacantu ||
Translation: This let the immolators set in order and dress the sacrifice with perfect cooking.

Sanskit Text: यत ते गात्रादग्निना पच्यमानादभि शूलं निहतस्यावधावति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te ghātrādaghninā pacyamānādabhi śūlaṃ nihatasyāvadhāvati |
Translation: 11 What from thy body which with fire is roasted, when thou art set upon the spit, distilleth,

Sanskit Text: मा तद भूम्यामा शरिषन मा तर्णेषु देवेभ्यस्तदुशद्भ्यो रातमस्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā tad bhūmyāmā śriṣan mā tṛṇeṣu devebhyastaduśadbhyo rātamastu ||
Translation: Let not that lie on earth or grass neglected, but to the longing Gods let all be offered.

Sanskit Text: ये वाजिनं परिपश्यन्ति पक्वं य ईमाहुः सुरभिर्निर्हरेति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye vājinaṃ paripaśyanti pakvaṃ ya īmāhuḥ surabhirnirhareti |
Translation: 12 They who observing that the Horse is ready call out and say, the smell is good; remove it;

Sanskit Text: ये चार्वतो मांसभिक्षामुपासत उतो तेषामभिगूर्तिर्न इन्वतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye cārvato māṃsabhikṣāmupāsata uto teṣāmabhighūrtirna invatu ||
Translation: And, craving meat, await the distribution,—may their approving help promote labour.

Sanskit Text: यन नीक्षणं मांस्पचन्या उखाया या पात्राणि यूष्णासेचनानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yan nīkṣaṇaṃ māṃspacanyā ukhāyā yā pātrāṇi yūṣṇaāsecanāni |
Translation: 13 The trial-fork of the flesh-cooking caldron, the vessels out of which the broth is sprinkled,

Sanskit Text: ऊष्मण्यापिधाना चरूणामङकाः सूनाःपरि भूषन्त्यश्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūṣmaṇyāpidhānā carūṇāmaṅkāḥ sūnāḥpari bhūṣantyaśvam ||
Translation: The warming-pots, the covers of the dishes, hooks, carving-boards,—all these attend the Charger.

Sanskit Text: निक्रमणं निषदनं विवर्तनं यच्च पड्बीशमर्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nikramaṇaṃ niṣadanaṃ vivartanaṃ yacca paḍbīśamarvataḥ |
Translation: 14 The starting-place, his place of rest and rolling, the ropes wherewith the Charger's feet were fastened,

Sanskit Text: यच्च पपौ यच्च घासिं जघास सर्वा ता ते अपि देवेष्वस्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yacca papau yacca ghāsiṃ jaghāsa sarvā tā te api deveṣvastu ||
Translation: The water that he drank, the food he tasted,—among the Gods, too, may all these attend thee.

Sanskit Text: मा तवाग्निर्ध्वनयीद धूमगन्धिर्मोखा भराजन्त्यभि विक्त जघ्रिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā tvāghnirdhvanayīd dhūmaghandhirmokhā bhrājantyabhi vikta jaghriḥ |
Translation: 15 Let not the fire, smoke-scented, make thee crackle, nor glowing caldron smell and break to pieces.

Sanskit Text: इष्टं वीतमभिगूर्तं वषट्क्र्तं तं देवासः परति गर्भ्णन्त्यश्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣṭaṃ vītamabhighūrtaṃ vaṣaṭkṛtaṃ taṃ devāsaḥ prati ghṛbhṇantyaśvam ||
Translation: Offered, beloved, approved, and consecrated,—such Charger do the Gods accept with favour.

Sanskit Text: यदश्वाय वास उपस्त्र्णन्त्यधीवासं या हिरण्यान्यस्मै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadaśvāya vāsa upastṛṇantyadhīvāsaṃ yā hiraṇyānyasmai |
Translation: 16 The robe they spread upon the Horse to clothe him, the upper covering and the golden trappings,

Sanskit Text: सन्दानमर्वन्तं पड्बीशं परिया देवेष्वा यामयन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sandānamarvantaṃ paḍbīśaṃ priyā deveṣvā yāmayanti ||
Translation: The halters which restrain the Steed, the heel-ropes,—all these, as grateful to the Gods, they offer.

Sanskit Text: यत ते सादे महसा शूक्र्तस्य पार्ष्ण्या वा कशया वा तुतोद |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te sāde mahasā śūkṛtasya pārṣṇyā vā kaśayā vā tutoda |
Translation: 17 If one, when seated, with excessive urging hath with his heel or with his whip distressed thee,

Sanskit Text: सरुचेव ता हविषो अध्वरेषु सर्वा ता ते बरह्मणासूदयामि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sruceva tā haviṣo adhvareṣu sarvā tā te brahmaṇāsūdayāmi ||
Translation: All these thy woes, as with the oblations' ladle at sacrifices, with my prayer I banish.

Sanskit Text: चतुस्त्रिंशद वाजिनो देवबन्धोर्वङकरीरश्वस्य सवधितिःसमेति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: catustriṃśad vājino devabandhorvaṅkrīraśvasya svadhitiḥsameti |
Translation: 18 The four-and-thirty ribs of the. Swift Charger, kin to the Gods, the slayer's hatchet pierces.

Sanskit Text: अछिद्रा गात्रा वयुना कर्णोत परुष-परुरनुघुष्य वि शस्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: achidrā ghātrā vayunā kṛṇota paruṣ-paruranughuṣya vi śasta ||
Translation: Cut ye with skill, so that the parts be flawless, and piece by piece declaring them dissect them.

Sanskit Text: एकस्त्वष्तुरश्वस्या विशस्ता दवा यन्तारा भवतस्तथर्तुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ekastvaṣturaśvasyā viśastā dvā yantārā bhavatastathaṛtuḥ |
Translation: 19 Of Tvaṣṭar's Charger there is one dissector,—this is the custom-two there are who guide him.

Sanskit Text: या ते गात्राणां रतुथा कर्णोमि ता-ता पिण्डनां पर जुहोम्यग्नौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā te ghātrāṇāṃ ṛtuthā kṛṇomi tā-tā piṇḍanāṃ pra juhomyaghnau ||
Translation: Such of his limbs as I divide in order, these, amid the balls, in fire I offer.

Sanskit Text: मा तवा तपत परिय आत्मापियन्तं मा सवधितिस्तन्व आ तिष्ठिपत ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā tvā tapat priya ātmāpiyantaṃ mā svadhitistanva ā tiṣṭhipat te |
Translation: 20 Let not thy dear soul burn thee as thou comest, let not the hatchet linger in thy body.

Sanskit Text: मा ते गर्ध्नुरविशस्तातिहाय छिद्रा गात्रण्यसिना मिथू कः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā te ghṛdhnuraviśastātihāya chidrā ghātraṇyasinā mithū kaḥ ||
Translation: Let not a greedy clumsy immolator, missing the joints, mangle thy limbs unduly.

Sanskit Text: न वा उ एतन मरियसे न रिष्यसि देवानिदेषि पथिभिः सुगेभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na vā u etan mriyase na riṣyasi devānideṣi pathibhiḥ sughebhiḥ |
Translation: 21 No, here thou diest not, thou art not injured: by easy paths unto the Gods thou goest.

Sanskit Text: हरी ते युञ्जा पर्षती अभूतामुपास्थाद वाजी धुरि रासभस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: harī te yuñjā pṛṣatī abhūtāmupāsthād vājī dhuri rāsabhasya ||
Translation: Both Bays, both spotted mares are now thy fellows, and to the ass's pole is yoked the Charger.

Sanskit Text: सुगव्यं नो वाजी सवश्व्यं पुंसः पुत्रानुत विश्वापुषं रयिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sughavyaṃ no vājī svaśvyaṃ puṃsaḥ putrānuta viśvāpuṣaṃ rayim |
Translation: 22 May this Steed bring us all-sustaining riches, wealth in good kine, good horses, manly offspring.

Sanskit Text: अनागास्त्वं नो अदितिः कर्णोतु कषत्रं नो अश्वो वनतां हविष्मान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anāghāstvaṃ no aditiḥ kṛṇotu kṣatraṃ no aśvo vanatāṃ haviṣmān ||
Translation: Freedom from sin may Aditi vouchsafe us: the Steed with our oblations gain us lordship!

Sanskit Text: अस्य वामस्य पलितस्य होतुस्तस्य भराता मध्यमो अस्त्यश्नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya vāmasya palitasya hotustasya bhrātā madhyamo astyaśnaḥ |
Translation: 1. OF this benignant Priest, with eld grey-coloured, the brother midmost of the three is lightning.

Sanskit Text: तर्तीयो भराता घर्तप्र्ष्ठो अस्यात्रापश्यं विश्पतिं सप्तपुत्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tṛtīyo bhrātā ghṛtapṛṣṭho asyātrāpaśyaṃ viśpatiṃ saptaputram ||
Translation: The third is he whose back with oil is sprinkled. Here I behold the Chief with seven male children.

Sanskit Text: सप्त युञ्जन्ति रथमेकचक्रमेको अश्वो वहति सप्तनामा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sapta yuñjanti rathamekacakrameko aśvo vahati saptanāmā |
Translation: 2 Seven to the one-wheeled chariot yoke the Courser; bearing seven names the single Courser draws it.

Sanskit Text: तरिनाभि चक्रमजरमनर्वं यत्रेमा विश्वा भुवनाधितस्थुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trinābhi cakramajaramanarvaṃ yatremā viśvā bhuvanādhitasthuḥ ||
Translation: Three-naved the wheel is, sound and undecaying, whereon are resting all these worlds of being.

Sanskit Text: इमं रथमधि ये सप्त तस्थुः सप्तचक्रं सप्त वहन्त्यश्वाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ rathamadhi ye sapta tasthuḥ saptacakraṃ sapta vahantyaśvāḥ |
Translation: 3 The seven who on the seven-wheeled car are mounted have horses, seven in tale, who draw them onward.

Sanskit Text: सप्त सवसारो अभि सं नवन्ते यत्र गवां निहिता सप्त नाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sapta svasāro abhi saṃ navante yatra ghavāṃ nihitā sapta nāma ||
Translation: Seven Sisters utter songs of praise together, in whom the names of the seven Cows are treasured.

Sanskit Text: को ददर्श परथमं जायमानमस्थन्वन्तं यदनस्था बिभर्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko dadarśa prathamaṃ jāyamānamasthanvantaṃ yadanasthā bibharti |
Translation: 4 Who hath beheld him as he sprang to being, seen how the boneless One supports the bony?

Sanskit Text: भूम्या असुरस्र्गात्मा कव सवित को विद्वांसमुप गात परष्टुमेतत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūmyā asurasṛghātmā kva svit ko vidvāṃsamupa ghāt praṣṭumetat ||
Translation: Where is the blood of earth, the life, the spirit? Who may approach the man who knows, to ask it?

Sanskit Text: पाकः पर्छामि मनसाविजानन देवानामेना निहिता पदानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pākaḥ pṛchāmi manasāvijānan devānāmenā nihitā padāni |
Translation: 5 Unripe in mind, in spirit undiscerning, I ask of these the Gods’ established places;

Sanskit Text: वत्से बष्कये.अधि सप्त तन्तून वि तत्निरे कवय ओतवाु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vatse baṣkaye.adhi sapta tantūn vi tatnire kavaya otavāu ||
Translation: For up above the yearling Calf the sages, to form a web, their own seven threads have woven.

Sanskit Text: अचिकित्वाञ्चिकितुषश्चिदत्र कवीन पर्छामि विद्मने न विद्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: acikitvāñcikituṣaścidatra kavīn pṛchāmi vidmane na vidvān |
Translation: 6 I ask, unknowing, those who know, the sages, as one all ignorant for sake of knowledge,

Sanskit Text: वि यस्तस्तम्भ षळ इमा रजांस्यजस्य रूपे किमपि सविदेकम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yastastambha ṣaḷ imā rajāṃsyajasya rūpe kimapi svidekam ||
Translation: What was that ONE who in the Unborn's image hath stablished and fixed firm these worlds' six regions.

Sanskit Text: इह बरवीतु य ईमङग वेदास्य वामस्य निहितं पदं वेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iha bravītu ya īmaṅgha vedāsya vāmasya nihitaṃ padaṃ veḥ |
Translation: 7 Let him who knoweth presently declare it, this lovely Bird's securely founded station.

Sanskit Text: शीर्ष्णः कषीरं दुह्रते गावो अस्य वव्रिं वसाना उदकं पदापुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śīrṣṇaḥ kṣīraṃ duhrate ghāvo asya vavriṃ vasānā udakaṃ padāpuḥ ||
Translation: Forth from his head the Cows draw milk, and, wearing his vesture, with their foot have drunk the water.

Sanskit Text: माता पितरं रत आ बभाज धीत्यग्रे मनसा सं हि जग्मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mātā pitaraṃ ṛta ā babhāja dhītyaghre manasā saṃ hi jaghme |
Translation: 8 The Mother gave the Sire his share of Order: with thought, at first, she wedded him in spirit.

Sanskit Text: सा बीभत्सुर्गर्भरसा निविद्धा नमस्वन्त इदुपवाकमीयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā bībhatsurgharbharasā nividdhā namasvanta idupavākamīyuḥ ||
Translation: She, the coy Dame, was filled with dew prolific: with adoration men approached to praise her.

Sanskit Text: युक्ता मातासीद धुरि दक्षिणाया अतिष्ठद गर्भो वर्जनीष्वन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuktā mātāsīd dhuri dakṣiṇāyā atiṣṭhad gharbho vṛjanīṣvantaḥ |
Translation: 9 Yoked was the Mother to the boon Cow's car-pole: in the dank rows of cloud the Infant rested.

Sanskit Text: अमीमेद वत्सो अनु गामपश्यद विश्वरूप्यं तरिषु योजनेषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: amīmed vatso anu ghāmapaśyad viśvarūpyaṃ triṣu yojaneṣu ||
Translation: Then the Calf lowed, and looked upon the Mother, the Cow who wears all shapes in three directions.

Sanskit Text: तिस्रो मातॄस्त्रीन पितॄन बिभ्रदेक ऊर्ध्वस्तस्थौ नेमव गलापयन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisro mātṝstrīn pitṝn bibhradeka ūrdhvastasthau nemava ghlāpayanti |
Translation: 10 Bearing three Mothers and three Fathers, single he stood erect: they never make him weary.

Sanskit Text: मन्त्रयन्ते दिवो अमुष्य पर्ष्ठे विश्वविदं वाचमविश्वमिन्वाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mantrayante divo amuṣya pṛṣṭhe viśvavidaṃ vācamaviśvaminvām ||
Translation: There on the pitch of heaven they speak together in speech all-knowing but not all-impelling.

Sanskit Text: दवादशारं नहि तज्जराय वर्वर्ति चक्रं परि दयां रतस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvādaśāraṃ nahi tajjarāya varvarti cakraṃ pari dyāṃ ṛtasya |
Translation: 11 Formed with twelve spokes, by length of time, unweakened, rolls round the heaven this wheel of during Order.

Sanskit Text: आ पुत्रा अग्ने मिथुनासो अत्र सप्त शतानि विंशतिश्च तस्थुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā putrā aghne mithunāso atra sapta śatāni viṃśatiśca tasthuḥ ||
Translation: Herein established, joined in pairs together, seven hundred Sons and twenty stand, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: पञ्चपादं पितरं दवादशाक्र्तिं दिव आहुः परे अर्धे पुरीषिणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pañcapādaṃ pitaraṃ dvādaśākṛtiṃ diva āhuḥ pare ardhe purīṣiṇam |
Translation: 12 They call him in the farther half of heaven the Sire five-footed, of twelve forms, wealthy in watery store.

Sanskit Text: अथेमे अन्य उपरे विचक्षणं सप्तचक्रे षळर आहुरर्पितम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atheme anya upare vicakṣaṇaṃ saptacakre ṣaḷara āhurarpitam ||
Translation: These others say that he, God with far-seeing eyes, is mounted on the lower seven-wheeled, six-spoked car.

Sanskit Text: पञ्चारे चक्रे परिवर्तमाने तस्मिन्ना तस्थुर्भुवनानि विश्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pañcāre cakre parivartamāne tasminnā tasthurbhuvanāni viśvā |
Translation: 13 Upon this five-spoked wheel revolving ever all living creatures rest and are dependent.

Sanskit Text: तस्य नाक्षस्तप्यते भूरिभारः सनादेव न शीर्यते सनाभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya nākṣastapyate bhūribhāraḥ sanādeva na śīryate sanābhiḥ ||
Translation: Its axle, heavy-laden, is not heated: the nave from ancient time remains unbroken.

Sanskit Text: सनेमि चक्रमजरं वि वाव्र्त उत्तानायां दश युक्ता वहन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanemi cakramajaraṃ vi vāvṛta uttānāyāṃ daśa yuktā vahanti |
Translation: 14 The wheel revolves, unwasting, with its felly: ten draw it, yoked to the far-stretching car-pole.

Sanskit Text: सूर्यस्य चक्षू रजसैत्याव्र्तं तस्मिन्नार्पिता भुवनानि विश्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūryasya cakṣū rajasaityāvṛtaṃ tasminnārpitā bhuvanāni viśvā ||
Translation: The Sun's eye moves encompassed by the region: on him dependent rest all living creatures.

Sanskit Text: साकंजानां सप्तथमहुरेकजं षळ इद यमा रषयो देवजा इति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sākaṃjānāṃ saptathamahurekajaṃ ṣaḷ id yamā ṛṣayo devajā iti |
Translation: 15 Of the co-born they call the seventh single-born; the six twin pairs are called Ṛṣis, Children of Gods.

Sanskit Text: तेषामिष्टानि विहितानि धामश सथात्रे रेजन्ते विक्र्तानि रूपशः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: teṣāmiṣṭāni vihitāni dhāmaśa sthātre rejante vikṛtāni rūpaśaḥ ||
Translation: Their good gifts sought of men are ranged in order due, and various in their form move for the Lord who guides.

Sanskit Text: सत्रियः सतीस्तानु मे पुंस आहुः पश्यदक्षण्वान नवि चेतदन्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: striyaḥ satīstānu me puṃsa āhuḥ paśyadakṣaṇvān navi cetadandhaḥ |
Translation: 16 They told me these were males, though truly females: he who hath eyes sees this, the blind discerns not.

Sanskit Text: कविर्यः पुत्रः स ईमा चिकेत यस्ता विजानात स पितुष पितासत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaviryaḥ putraḥ sa īmā ciketa yastā vijānāt sa pituṣ pitāsat ||
Translation: The son who is a sage hath comprehended: who knows this rightly is his father's father.

Sanskit Text: अवः परेण पर एनावरेण पदा वत्सं बिभ्रती गौरुदस्थात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avaḥ pareṇa para enāvareṇa padā vatsaṃ bibhratī ghaurudasthāt |
Translation: 17 Beneath the upper realm, above this lower, bearing her calf at foot the Cow hath risen.

Sanskit Text: सा कद्रीची कं सविदर्धं परागात कव सवित सूते नहि यूथे अन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā kadrīcī kaṃ svidardhaṃ parāghāt kva svit sūte nahi yūthe antaḥ ||
Translation: Witherward, to what place hath she departed? Where calves she? Not amid this herd of cattle.

Sanskit Text: अवः परेण पितरं यो अस्यानुवेद पर एनावरेण |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avaḥ pareṇa pitaraṃ yo asyānuveda para enāvareṇa |
Translation: 18 Who, that the father of this Calf discerneth beneath the upper realm, above the lower,

Sanskit Text: कवीयमानः क इह पर वोचद देवं मनः कुतो अधि पराजातम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kavīyamānaḥ ka iha pra vocad devaṃ manaḥ kuto adhi prājātam ||
Translation: Showing himself a sage, may here declare it? Whence hath the Godlike spirit had its rising?

Sanskit Text: ये अर्वाञ्चस्तानु पराच आहुर्ये पराञ्चस्तानु अर्वाच आहुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye arvāñcastānu parāca āhurye parāñcastānu arvāca āhuḥ |
Translation: 19 Those that come hitherward they call departing, those that depart they call directed hither.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रश्च या चक्रथुः सोम तानि धुरा न युक्ता रजसो वहन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraśca yā cakrathuḥ soma tāni dhurā na yuktā rajaso vahanti ||
Translation: And what so ye have made, Indra and Soma, steeds bear as ’twere yoked to the region's car-pole.

Sanskit Text: दवा सुपर्णा सयुजा सखाया समानं वर्क्षं परि षस्वजाते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvā suparṇā sayujā sakhāyā samānaṃ vṛkṣaṃ pari ṣasvajāte |
Translation: 20 Two Birds with fair wings, knit with bonds of friendship, in the same sheltering tree have found a refuge.

Sanskit Text: तयोरन्यः पिप्पलं सवाद्वत्त्यनश्नन्नन्यो अभि चाकशीति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tayoranyaḥ pippalaṃ svādvattyanaśnannanyo abhi cākaśīti ||
Translation: One of the twain eats the sweet Fig-tree's fruitage; the other eating not regardeth only.

Sanskit Text: यत्रा सुपर्णा अम्र्तस्य भागमनिमेषं विदथाभिस्वरन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatrā suparṇā amṛtasya bhāghamanimeṣaṃ vidathābhisvaranti |
Translation: 21 Where those fine Birds hymn ceaselessly their portion of life eternal, and the sacred synods,

Sanskit Text: इनो विश्वस्य भुवनस्य गोपाः स मा धीरः पाकमत्रा विवेश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ino viśvasya bhuvanasya ghopāḥ sa mā dhīraḥ pākamatrā viveśa ||
Translation: There is the Universe's mighty Keeper, who, wise, hath entered into me the simple.

Sanskit Text: यस्मिन वर्क्षे मध्वदः सुपर्णा निविशन्ते सुवते चाधि विश्वे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasmin vṛkṣe madhvadaḥ suparṇā niviśante suvate cādhi viśve |
Translation: 22 The, tree whereon the fine Birds eat the sweetness, where they all rest and procreate their offspring,—

Sanskit Text: तस्येदाहुः पिप्पलं सवाद्वग्रे तन नोन नशद यःपितरं न वेद ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasyedāhuḥ pippalaṃ svādvaghre tan non naśad yaḥpitaraṃ na veda ||
Translation: Upon its top they say the fig is luscious: none gaineth it who knoweth not the Father.

Sanskit Text: यद गायत्रे अधि गायत्रमाहितं तरैष्टुभाद वा तरैष्टुभं निरतक्षत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad ghāyatre adhi ghāyatramāhitaṃ traiṣṭubhād vā traiṣṭubhaṃ niratakṣata |
Translation: 23 How on the Gāyatrī the Gāyatrī was based, how from the Triṣṭup they fashioned the Triṣṭup forth,

Sanskit Text: यद वा जगज्जगत्याहितं पदं य इत तद विदुस्ते अम्र्तत्वमानशुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā jaghajjaghatyāhitaṃ padaṃ ya it tad viduste amṛtatvamānaśuḥ ||
Translation: How on the Jagatī was based the Jagatī,—they who know this have won themselves immortal life.

Sanskit Text: गायत्रेण परति मिमीते अर्कमर्केण साम तरैष्टुभेन वाकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāyatreṇa prati mimīte arkamarkeṇa sāma traiṣṭubhena vākam |
Translation: 24 With Gāyatrī he measures out the praise-song, Sāma with praise-song, triplet with the Triṣṭup.

Sanskit Text: वाकेन वाकं दविपदा चतुष्पदाक्षरेण मिमते सप्त वाणीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vākena vākaṃ dvipadā catuṣpadākṣareṇa mimate sapta vāṇīḥ ||
Translation: The triplet with the two or four-foot measure, and with the syllable they form seven metres.

Sanskit Text: जगता सिन्धुं दिव्यस्थभायद रथन्तरे सूर्यं पर्यपश्यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jaghatā sindhuṃ divyasthabhāyad rathantare sūryaṃ paryapaśyat |
Translation: 25 With Jagatī the flood in heaven he stablished, and saw the Sun in the Rathantara Sāman.

Sanskit Text: गायत्रस्य समिधस्तिस्र आहुस्ततो मह्ना पर रिरिचे महित्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāyatrasya samidhastisra āhustato mahnā pra ririce mahitvā ||
Translation: Gāyatrī hath, they say, three brands for kindling: hence it excels in majesty and vigour.

Sanskit Text: उप हवये सुदुघां धेनुमेतां सुहस्तो गोधुगुत दोहदेनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa hvaye sudughāṃ dhenumetāṃ suhasto ghodhughuta dohadenām |
Translation: 26 I invocate the milch-cow good for milking so that the milker, deft of hand, may drain her.

Sanskit Text: शरेष्ठं सवं सविता साविषन नो.अभीद्धो घर्मस्तदु षु पर वोचम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śreṣṭhaṃ savaṃ savitā sāviṣan no.abhīddho gharmastadu ṣu pra vocam ||
Translation: May Savitar give goodliest stimulation. The caldron is made hot; I will proclaim it.

Sanskit Text: हिङकर्ण्वती वसुपत्नी वसूनां वत्समिछन्ती मनसाभ्यागात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiṅkṛṇvatī vasupatnī vasūnāṃ vatsamichantī manasābhyāghāt |
Translation: 27 She, lady of all treasure, is come hither yearning in spirit for her calf and lowing.

Sanskit Text: दुहामश्विभ्यां पयो अघ्न्येयं स वर्धतां महते सौभगाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: duhāmaśvibhyāṃ payo aghnyeyaṃ sa vardhatāṃ mahate saubhaghāya ||
Translation: May this cow yield her milk for both the Aśvins, and may she prosper to our high advantage.

Sanskit Text: गौरमीमेदनु वत्सं मिषन्तं मूर्धानं हिंं अक्र्णोन मातवा उ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghauramīmedanu vatsaṃ miṣantaṃ mūrdhānaṃ hiṃṃ akṛṇon mātavā u |
Translation: 28 The cow hath lowed after her blinking youngling; she licks his forehead, as she lows, to form it.

Sanskit Text: सर्क्वाणं घर्ममभि वावशाना मिमाति मायुं पयते पयोभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sṛkvāṇaṃ gharmamabhi vāvaśānā mimāti māyuṃ payate payobhiḥ ||
Translation: His mouth she fondly calls to her warm udder, and suckles him with milk while gently lowing.

Sanskit Text: अयं स शिङकते येन गौरभीव्र्ता मिमाति मायुं धवसनावधि शरिता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ sa śiṅkte yena ghaurabhīvṛtā mimāti māyuṃ dhvasanāvadhi śritā |
Translation: 29 He also snorts, by whom encompassed round the Cow laws as she clings unto the shedder of the rain.

Sanskit Text: सा चित्तिभिर्नि हि चकार मर्त्यं विद्युद भवन्ती परति वव्रिमौहत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā cittibhirni hi cakāra martyaṃ vidyud bhavantī prati vavrimauhata ||
Translation: She with her shrilling cries hath humbled mortal man, and, turned to lightning, hath stripped off her covering robe.

Sanskit Text: अनच्छये तुरगातु जीवमेजद धरुवं मध्य आ पस्त्यानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anacchaye turaghātu jīvamejad dhruvaṃ madhya ā pastyānām |
Translation: 30 That which hath breath and speed and life and motion lies firmly stablished in the midst of houses.

Sanskit Text: जीवो मर्तस्य चरति सवधाभिरमर्त्यो मर्त्येना सयोनिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jīvo mṛtasya carati svadhābhiramartyo martyenā sayoniḥ ||
Translation: Living, by offerings to the Dead he moveth Immortal One, the brother of the mortal.

Sanskit Text: अपश्यं गोपामनिपद्यमानमा च परा च पथिभिश्चरन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apaśyaṃ ghopāmanipadyamānamā ca parā ca pathibhiścarantam |
Translation: 31 I saw the Herdsman, him who never stumbles, approaching by his pathways and departing.

Sanskit Text: स सध्रीचीः स विशूचीर्वसान आ वरीवर्ति भुवनेष्वन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sadhrīcīḥ sa viśūcīrvasāna ā varīvarti bhuvaneṣvantaḥ ||
Translation: He, clothed with gathered and diffusive splendour, within the worlds continually travels.

Sanskit Text: य ईं चकार न सो अस्य वेद य ईं ददर्श हिरुगिन नुतस्मात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya īṃ cakāra na so asya veda ya īṃ dadarśa hirughin nutasmāt |
Translation: 32 He who hath made him cloth not comprehend him: from him who saw him surely is he hidden.

Sanskit Text: स मातुर्योना परिवीतो अन्तर्बहुप्रजा निर्र्तिमा विवेश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa māturyonā parivīto antarbahuprajā nirṛtimā viveśa ||
Translation: He, yet enveloped in his Mother's bosom, source of much life, hath sunk into destruction.

Sanskit Text: दयौर्मे पिता जनिता नाभिरत्र बन्धुर्मे माता पर्थिवीमहीयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyaurme pitā janitā nābhiratra bandhurme mātā pṛthivīmahīyam |
Translation: 33 Dyaus is my Father, my begetter: kinship is here. This great earth is my kin and Mother.

Sanskit Text: उत्तानयोश्चम्वोर्योनिरन्तरत्रा पिता दुहितुर्गर्भमाधात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uttānayoścamvoryonirantaratrā pitā duhiturgharbhamādhāt ||
Translation: Between the wide-spread world-halves is the birth-place: the Father laid the Daughter's germ within it.

Sanskit Text: पर्छामि तवा परमन्तं पर्थिव्याः पर्छामि यत्र भुवनस्यनाभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛchāmi tvā paramantaṃ pṛthivyāḥ pṛchāmi yatra bhuvanasyanābhiḥ |
Translation: 34 I ask thee of the earth's extremest limit, where is the centre of the world, I ask thee.

Sanskit Text: पर्छामि तवा वर्ष्णो अश्वस्य रेतः पर्छामि वाचः परमं वयोम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛchāmi tvā vṛṣṇo aśvasya retaḥ pṛchāmi vācaḥ paramaṃ vyoma ||
Translation: I ask thee of the Stallion's seed prolific, I ask of highest heaven where Speech abideth.

Sanskit Text: इयं वेदिः परो अन्तः पर्थिव्या अयं यज्ञो भुवनस्य नाभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyaṃ vediḥ paro antaḥ pṛthivyā ayaṃ yajño bhuvanasya nābhiḥ |
Translation: 35 This altar is the earth's extremest limit; this sacrifice of ours is the world's centre.

Sanskit Text: अयं सोमो वर्ष्णो अश्वस्य रेतो बरह्मायं वाचःपरमं वयोम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ somo vṛṣṇo aśvasya reto brahmāyaṃ vācaḥparamaṃ vyoma ||
Translation: The Stallion's seed prolific is the Soma; this Brahman highest heaven where Speech abideth.

Sanskit Text: सप्तार्धगर्भा भुवनस्य रेतो विष्णोस्तिष्ठन्ति परदिशाविधर्मणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saptārdhagharbhā bhuvanasya reto viṣṇostiṣṭhanti pradiśāvidharmaṇi |
Translation: 36 Seven germs unripened yet are heaven's prolific seed: their functions they maintain by Viṣṇu's ordinance.

Sanskit Text: ते धीतिभिर्मनसा ते विपश्चितः परिभुवः परि भवन्ति विश्वतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te dhītibhirmanasā te vipaścitaḥ paribhuvaḥ pari bhavanti viśvataḥ ||
Translation: Endued with wisdom through intelligence and thought, they compass us about present on every side.

Sanskit Text: अन वि जानामि यदिवेदमस्मि निण्यः संनद्धो मनसा चरामि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: an vi jānāmi yadivedamasmi niṇyaḥ saṃnaddho manasā carāmi |
Translation: 37 What thing I truly am I know not clearly: mysterious, fettered in my mind I wander.

Sanskit Text: यदा मागन परथमजा रतस्यादिद व[चो अश्नुवे भागमस्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā māghan prathamajā ṛtasyādid va[co aśnuve bhāghamasyāḥ ||
Translation: When the first-born of holy Law approached me, then of this speech I first obtain a portion.

Sanskit Text: अपां परां एति सवधया गर्भीतो.अमर्त्यो मर्त्येना सयोनिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāṃ prāṃ eti svadhayā ghṛbhīto.amartyo martyenā sayoniḥ |
Translation: 38 Back, forward goes he, grasped by strength inherent, the Immortal born the brother of the mortal

Sanskit Text: ता शश्वन्ता विषूचीना वियन्ता नयन्यं चिक्युर्न निचिक्युरन्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā śaśvantā viṣūcīnā viyantā nyanyaṃ cikyurna nicikyuranyam ||
Translation: Ceaseless they move in opposite directions: men mark the one, and fail to mark the other.

Sanskit Text: रचो अक्षरे परमे वयोमन यस्मिन देवा अधि विश्वे निषेदुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛco akṣare parame vyoman yasmin devā adhi viśve niṣeduḥ |
Translation: 39 Upon what syllable of holy praise-song, as twere their highest heaven, the Gods repose them,—

Sanskit Text: यस्तन न वेद किं रचा करिष्यति य इत तद विदुस्त इमे समासते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yastan na veda kiṃ ṛcā kariṣyati ya it tad vidusta ime samāsate ||
Translation: Who knows not this, what will he do with praise-song? But they who know it well sit here assembled.

Sanskit Text: सूयवसाद भगवती हि भूया अथो वयं भगवन्तः सयाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūyavasād bhaghavatī hi bhūyā atho vayaṃ bhaghavantaḥ syāma |

Sanskit Text: <a href="errata.htm#5">
Fortunate
mayst thou be with goodly pasture, and may we also be exceeding wealthy.
अद्धि तर्णमघ्न्ये विश्वदानीं पिब शुद्धमुदकमाचरन्ती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: addhi tṛṇamaghnye viśvadānīṃ piba śuddhamudakamācarantī ||
Translation: Feed on the grass, O Cow, at every season, and coming hitherward drink limpid water.

Sanskit Text: गौरीर्मिमाय सलिलानि तक्षत्येकपदी दविपदी सा चतुष्पदी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghaurīrmimāya salilāni takṣatyekapadī dvipadī sā catuṣpadī |
Translation: 41 Forming the water-floods, the buffalo hath lowed, one-footed or two-footed or four-footed, she,

Sanskit Text: अष्टापदी नवपदी बभूवुषी सहस्राक्षरा परमे वयोमन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṣṭāpadī navapadī babhūvuṣī sahasrākṣarā parame vyoman ||
Translation: Who hath become eight-footed or hath got nine feet, the thousand-syllabled in the sublimest heaven.

Sanskit Text: तस्याः समुद्रा अधि वि कषरन्ति तेन जीवन्ति परदिशश्चतस्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasyāḥ samudrā adhi vi kṣaranti tena jīvanti pradiśaścatasraḥ |
Translation: 42 From her descend in streams the seas of water; thereby the world's four regions have their being,

Sanskit Text: ततः कषरत्यक्षरं तद विश्वमुप जीवति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tataḥ kṣaratyakṣaraṃ tad viśvamupa jīvati ||
Translation: Thence flows the imperishable flood and thence the universe hath life.

Sanskit Text: शकमयं धूममारादपश्यं विषूवता पर एनावरेण |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śakamayaṃ dhūmamārādapaśyaṃ viṣūvatā para enāvareṇa |
Translation: 43 I saw from far away the smoke of fuel with spires that rose on high o’er that beneath it.

Sanskit Text: उक्षाणं पर्श्निमपचन्त वीरास्तानि धर्माणि परथमान्यासन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukṣāṇaṃ pṛśnimapacanta vīrāstāni dharmāṇi prathamānyāsan ||
Translation: The Mighty Men have dressed the spotted bullock. These were the customs in the days aforetime,

Sanskit Text: तरयः केशिन रतुथा वि चक्षते संवत्सरे वपत एक एषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trayaḥ keśina ṛtuthā vi cakṣate saṃvatsare vapata eka eṣām |
Translation: 44 Three with long tresses show in ordered season. One of them sheareth when the year is ended.

Sanskit Text: विश्वमेको अभि चष्टे शचीभिर्ध्राजिरेकस्य दद्र्शेन रूपम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvameko abhi caṣṭe śacībhirdhrājirekasya dadṛśena rūpam ||
Translation: One with his powers the universe regardeth: Of one, the sweep is seen, but his figure.

Sanskit Text: चत्वारि वाक परिमिता पदानि तानि विदुर्ब्राह्मणा ये मनीषिणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: catvāri vāk parimitā padāni tāni vidurbrāhmaṇā ye manīṣiṇaḥ |
Translation: 45 Speech hath been measured out in four divisions, the Brahmans who have understanding know them.

Sanskit Text: गुहा तरीणि निहिता नेङगयन्ति तुरीयं वाचो मनुष्या वदन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghuhā trīṇi nihitā neṅghayanti turīyaṃ vāco manuṣyā vadanti ||
Translation: Three kept in close concealment cause no motion; of speech, men speak only the fourth division.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं मित्रं वरुणमग्निमाहुरथो दिव्यः स सुपर्णो गरुत्मान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ mitraṃ varuṇamaghnimāhuratho divyaḥ sa suparṇo gharutmān |
Translation: 46 They call him Indra, Mitra, Varuṇa, Agni, and he is heavenly nobly-winged Garutmān.

Sanskit Text: एकं सद विप्रा बहुधा वदन्त्यग्निं यमं मातरिश्वानमाहुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ekaṃ sad viprā bahudhā vadantyaghniṃ yamaṃ mātariśvānamāhuḥ ||
Translation: To what is One, sages give many a title they call it Agni, Yama, Mātariśvan.

Sanskit Text: कर्ष्णं नियानं हरयः सुपर्णा अपो वसाना दिवमुत पतन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṣṇaṃ niyānaṃ harayaḥ suparṇā apo vasānā divamut patanti |
Translation: 47 Dark the descent: the birds are golden-coloured; up to the heaven they fly robed in the waters.

Sanskit Text: त आवव्र्त्रन सदनाद रतस्यादिद घर्तेन पर्थिवी वयुद्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta āvavṛtran sadanād ṛtasyādid ghṛtena pṛthivī vyudyate ||
Translation: Again descend they from the seat of Order, and all the earth is moistened with their fatness.

Sanskit Text: दवादश परधयश्चक्रमेकं तरीणि नभ्यानि क उ तच्चिकेत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvādaśa pradhayaścakramekaṃ trīṇi nabhyāni ka u tacciketa |
Translation: 48 Twelve are the fellies, and the wheel is single; three are the naves. What man hath understood it?

Sanskit Text: तस्मिन साकं तरिशता न शङकवो.अर्पिताः षष्टिर्न चलाचलासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmin sākaṃ triśatā na śaṅkavo.arpitāḥ ṣaṣṭirna calācalāsaḥ ||
Translation: Therein are set together spokes three hundred and sixty, which in nowise can be loosened.

Sanskit Text: यस्ते सतनः शशयो यो मयोभूर्येन विश्वा पुष्यसि वार्याणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaste stanaḥ śaśayo yo mayobhūryena viśvā puṣyasi vāryāṇi |
Translation: 49 That breast of thine exhaustless, spring of pleasure, wherewith thou feedest all things that are choicest,

Sanskit Text: यो रत्नधा वसुविद यः सुदत्रः सरस्वति तमिह धातवे कः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo ratnadhā vasuvid yaḥ sudatraḥ sarasvati tamiha dhātave kaḥ ||
Translation: Wealth-giver, treasure. finder, free bestower,—bring that, Sarasvatī, that we may drain it.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञेन यज्ञमयजन्त देवास्तनि धर्माणि परथमान्यासन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñena yajñamayajanta devāstani dharmāṇi prathamānyāsan |
Translation: 50 By means of sacrifice the Gods accomplished their sacrifice: these were the earliest ordinances.

Sanskit Text: ते ह नाकं महिमानः सचन्त यत्र पूर्वे साध्याः सन्ति देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te ha nākaṃ mahimānaḥ sacanta yatra pūrve sādhyāḥ santi devāḥ ||
Translation: These Mighty Ones attained the height of heaven, there where the Sādhyas, Gods of old, are dwelling.

Sanskit Text: समानमेतदुदकमुच्चैत्यव चाहभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samānametadudakamuccaityava cāhabhiḥ |
Translation: 51 Uniform, with the passing days, this water mounts and fails again.

Sanskit Text: भूमिं पर्जन्या जिन्वन्ति दिवं जिन्वन्त्यग्नयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūmiṃ parjanyā jinvanti divaṃ jinvantyaghnayaḥ ||
Translation: The tempest-clouds give life to earth, and fires re-animate the heaven.

Sanskit Text: दिव्यं सुपर्णं वायसं बर्हन्तमपां गर्भं दर्शतमोषधीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divyaṃ suparṇaṃ vāyasaṃ bṛhantamapāṃ gharbhaṃ darśatamoṣadhīnām |
Translation: 52 The Bird Celestial, vast with noble pinion, the lovely germ of plants, the germ of waters,

Sanskit Text: अभीपतो वर्ष्टिभिस्तर्पयन्तं सरस्वन्तमवसे जोहवीमि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhīpato vṛṣṭibhistarpayantaṃ sarasvantamavase johavīmi ||
Translation: Him who delighteth us with rain in season, Sarasvān I invoke that he may help us.

Sanskit Text: कया शुभा सवयसः सनीळाः समान्या मरुतः सं मिमिक्षुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kayā śubhā savayasaḥ sanīḷāḥ samānyā marutaḥ saṃ mimikṣuḥ |
Translation: 1. WITH what bright beauty are the Maruts jointly invested, peers in age, who dwell together?

Sanskit Text: कया मती कुत एतास एते.अर्चन्ति शुष्मं वर्षणो वसूया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kayā matī kuta etāsa ete.arcanti śuṣmaṃ vṛṣaṇo vasūyā ||
Translation: From what place have they come? With what intention? Sing they their strength through love of wealth, these Heroes?

Sanskit Text: कस्य बरह्माणि जुजुषुर्युवानः को अध्वरे मरुत आ ववर्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kasya brahmāṇi jujuṣuryuvānaḥ ko adhvare maruta ā vavarta |
Translation: 2 Whose prayers have they, the Youthful Ones, accepted? Who to his sacrifice hath turned the Maruts?

Sanskit Text: शयेनानिव धरजतो अन्तरिक्षे केन महा मनसा रीरमाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śyenāniva dhrajato antarikṣe kena mahā manasā rīramāma ||
Translation: We will delay them on their journey sweeping—with what high spirit!—through the air like eagles.

Sanskit Text: कुतस्त्वमिन्द्र माहिनः सन्नेको यासि सत्पते किं त इत्था |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kutastvamindra māhinaḥ sanneko yāsi satpate kiṃ ta itthā |
Translation: 3 Whence comest thou alone, thou who art mighty, Indra, Lord of the Brave? What is thy purpose?

Sanskit Text: सं पर्छसे समराणः शुभानैर्वोचेस्तन नो हरिवो यत्ते अस्मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ pṛchase samarāṇaḥ śubhānairvocestan no harivo yatte asme ||
Translation: Thou greetest us when meeting us the Bright Ones. Lord of Bay Steeds, say what thou hast against us.

Sanskit Text: बरह्माणि मे मतयः शं सुतासः शुष्म इयर्ति परभ्र्तो मे अद्रिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmāṇi me matayaḥ śaṃ sutāsaḥ śuṣma iyarti prabhṛto me adriḥ |
Translation: 4 Mine are devotions, hymns; sweet are libations. Strength stirs, and hurled forth is my bolt of thunder.

Sanskit Text: आ शासते परति हर्यन्त्युक्थेमा हरी वहतस्ता नो अछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā śāsate prati haryantyukthemā harī vahatastā no acha ||
Translation: They call for me, their lauds are longing for me. These my Bay Steeds bear me to these oblations.

Sanskit Text: अतो वयमन्तमेभिर्युजानाः सवक्षत्रेभिस्तन्वः शुम्भमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ato vayamantamebhiryujānāḥ svakṣatrebhistanvaḥ śumbhamānāḥ |
Translation: 5 Therefore together with our strong companions, having adorned our bodies, now we harness,

Sanskit Text: महोभिरेतानुप युज्महे नविन्द्र सवधामनु हि नो बभूथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahobhiretānupa yujmahe nvindra svadhāmanu hi no babhūtha ||
Translation: Our spotted deer with might, for thou, O Indra, hast learnt and understood our Godlike nature.

Sanskit Text: कव सया वो मरुतः सवधासीद यन मामेकं समधत्ताहिहत्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kva syā vo marutaḥ svadhāsīd yan māmekaṃ samadhattāhihatye |
Translation: 6 Where was that nature then of yours, O Maruts, that ye charged me alone to slay the Dragon?

Sanskit Text: अहं हयूग्रस्तविषस्तुविष्मान विश्वस्य शत्रोरनमं वधस्नैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ hyūghrastaviṣastuviṣmān viśvasya śatroranamaṃ vadhasnaiḥ ||
Translation: For I in truth am fierce and strong and mighty. I bent away from every foeman's weapons.

Sanskit Text: भूरि चकर्थ युज्येभिरस्मे समानेभिर्व्र्षभ पौंस्येभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūri cakartha yujyebhirasme samānebhirvṛṣabha pauṃsyebhiḥ |
Translation: 7 Yea, much hast thou achieved with us for comrades, with manly valour like thine own, thou Hero.

Sanskit Text: भूरीणि हि कर्णवामा शविष्ठेन्द्र करत्वा मरुतो यद्वशाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūrīṇi hi kṛṇavāmā śaviṣṭhendra kratvā maruto yadvaśāma ||
Translation: Much may we too achieve, O mightiest Indra, with our great power, we Maruts, when we will it.

Sanskit Text: वधीं वर्त्रं मरुत इन्द्रियेण सवेन भामेन तविषो बभूवान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vadhīṃ vṛtraṃ maruta indriyeṇa svena bhāmena taviṣo babhūvān |
Translation: 8 Vṛtra I slew by mine own strength, O Maruts, having waxed mighty in mine indignation.

Sanskit Text: अहमेता मनवे विश्वश्चन्द्राः सुगा अपश्चकर वज्रबाहुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahametā manave viśvaścandrāḥ sughā apaścakara vajrabāhuḥ ||
Translation: I with the thunder in my hand created for man these lucid softly flowing waters.

Sanskit Text: अनुत्तमा ते मघवन नकिर्नु न तवावानस्ति देवता विदानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anuttamā te maghavan nakirnu na tvāvānasti devatā vidānaḥ |
Translation: 9 Nothing, O Maghavan, stands firm before thee; among the Gods not one is found thine equal.

Sanskit Text: न जायमानो नशते न जातो यानि करिष्या कर्णुहिप्रव्र्द्ध ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na jāyamāno naśate na jāto yāni kariṣyā kṛṇuhipravṛddha ||
Translation: None born or springing into life comes nigh thee. Do what thou hast to do, exceeding mighty?

Sanskit Text: एकस्य चिन मे विभ्वस्त्वोजो या नु दध्र्ष्वान कर्णवै मनीषा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ekasya cin me vibhvastvojo yā nu dadhṛṣvān kṛṇavai manīṣā |
Translation: 10 Mine only be transcendent power, whatever I, daring in my spirit, may accomplish.

Sanskit Text: अहं हयूग्रो मरुतो विदानो यानि चयवमिन्द्र इदीश एषाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ hyūghro maruto vidāno yāni cyavamindra idīśa eṣām ||
Translation: For I am known as terrible, O Maruts I, Indra, am the Lord of what I ruined.

Sanskit Text: अमन्दन मा मरुत सतोमो अत्र यन मे नरः शरुत्यं बरह्म चक्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: amandan mā maruta stomo atra yan me naraḥ śrutyaṃ brahma cakra |
Translation: 11 Now, O ye Maruts, hath your praise rejoiced me, the glorious hymn which ye have made me, Heroes!

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय वर्ष्णे सुमखाय मह्यं सख्ये सखायस्तन्वेतनूभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya vṛṣṇe sumakhāya mahyaṃ sakhye sakhāyastanvetanūbhiḥ ||
Translation: For me, for Indra, champion strong in battle, for me, yourselves, as lovers for a lover.

Sanskit Text: एवेदेते परति मा रोचमाना अनेद्यः शरव एषो दधानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evedete prati mā rocamānā anedyaḥ śrava eṣo dadhānāḥ |
Translation: 12 Here, truly, they send forth their sheen to meet me, wearing their blameless glory and their vigour.

Sanskit Text: संचक्ष्या मरुतश्चन्द्रवर्णा अछान्त मे छदयाथा चनूनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃcakṣyā marutaścandravarṇā achānta me chadayāthā canūnam ||
Translation: When I have seen you, Maruts, in gay splendour, ye have delighted me, so now delight me.

Sanskit Text: को नवत्र मरुतो मामहे वः पर यातन सखीन्रछा सखायः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko nvatra maruto māmahe vaḥ pra yātana sakhīnrachā sakhāyaḥ |
Translation: 13 Who here hath magnified you, O ye Maruts? speed forward, O ye lovers, to your lovers.

Sanskit Text: मन्मानि चित्रा अपिवातयन्त एषां भूत नवेदा म रतानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manmāni citrā apivātayanta eṣāṃ bhūta navedā ma ṛtānām ||
Translation: Ye Radiant Ones, assisting their devotions, of these my holy rites he ye regardful.

Sanskit Text: आ यद दुवस्याद दुवसे न कारुरस्माञ्चक्रे मान्यस्य मेधा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yad duvasyād duvase na kārurasmāñcakre mānyasya medhā |
Translation: 14 To this hath Mānya's wisdom brought us, so as to aid, as aids the poet him who worships.

Sanskit Text: ओ षु वर्त्त मरुतो विप्रमछेमा बरह्माणि जरिता वोर्चत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: o ṣu vartta maruto vipramachemā brahmāṇi jaritā voarcat ||
Translation: Bring hither quick! On to the sage, ye Maruts! These prayers for you the singer hath recited.

Sanskit Text: एष व सतोमो मरुत इयं गीर्मान्दार्यस्य मान्यस्य करोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa va stomo maruta iyaṃ ghīrmāndāryasya mānyasya karoḥ |
Translation: 15 May this your praise, may this your song, O Maruts, sung by the poet, Māna's son, Māndārya,

Sanskit Text: एषा यासीष्ट तन्वे वयां विद्यामेषं वर्जनं जीरदानुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣā yāsīṣṭa tanve vayāṃ vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum ||
Translation: Bring offspring for ourselves with food to feed us. May we find strengthening food in full abundance!

Sanskit Text: सहस्रं त इन्द्रोतयो नः सहस्रमिषो हरिवो गूर्ततमाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasraṃ ta indrotayo naḥ sahasramiṣo harivo ghūrtatamāḥ |
Translation: 1. A THOUSAND are thy helps for us, O Indra: a thousand, Lord of Bays, thy choice refreshments.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रं रायो मादयध्यै सहस्रिण उप नो यन्तु वाजाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasraṃ rāyo mādayadhyai sahasriṇa upa no yantu vājāḥ ||
Translation: Wealth of a thousand sorts hast thou to cheer us: may precious goods come nigh to us in thousands.

Sanskit Text: आ नो.अवोभिर्मरुतो यान्त्वछा जयेष्ठेभिर्वा बर्हद्दिवैःसुमायाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no.avobhirmaruto yāntvachā jyeṣṭhebhirvā bṛhaddivaiḥsumāyāḥ |
Translation: 2 May the most sapient Maruts, with protection, with best boons brought from lofty heaven, approach us,

Sanskit Text: अध यदेषां नियुतः परमाः समुद्रस्य चिद्धनयन्त पारे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha yadeṣāṃ niyutaḥ paramāḥ samudrasya ciddhanayanta pāre ||
Translation: Now when their team of the most noble horses speeds even on the sea's extremest limit.

Sanskit Text: मिम्यक्ष येषु सुधिता घर्ताची हिरण्यनिर्णिगुपरा न रष्टिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mimyakṣa yeṣu sudhitā ghṛtācī hiraṇyanirṇighuparā na ṛṣṭiḥ |
Translation: 3 Close to them clings one moving in seclusion, like a man's wife, like a spear carried rearward,

Sanskit Text: गुहा चरन्ती मनुषो न योषा सभावती विदथ्येव सं वाक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghuhā carantī manuṣo na yoṣā sabhāvatī vidathyeva saṃ vāk ||
Translation: Well grasped, bright, decked with gold there is Vāk also, like to a courtly, eloquent dame, among them.

Sanskit Text: परा शुभ्रा अयासो यव्या साधारण्येव मरुतो मिमिक्षुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parā śubhrā ayāso yavyā sādhāraṇyeva maruto mimikṣuḥ |
Translation: 4 Far off the brilliant, never-weary Maruts cling to the young Maid as a joint possession.

Sanskit Text: न रोदसी अप नुदन्त घोरा जुषन्त वर्धं सख्याय देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na rodasī apa nudanta ghorā juṣanta vṛdhaṃ sakhyāya devāḥ ||
Translation: The fierce Gods drave not Rodasī before them, but wished for her to grow their friend and fellow.

Sanskit Text: जोषद यदीमसुर्या सचध्यै विषितस्तुका रोदसी नर्मणाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: joṣad yadīmasuryā sacadhyai viṣitastukā rodasī nṛmaṇāḥ |
Translation: 5 When chose immortal Rodasī to follow—she with loose tresses and heroic spirit—

Sanskit Text: आ सूर्येव विधतो रथं गात तवेषप्रतीका नभसो नेत्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā sūryeva vidhato rathaṃ ghāt tveṣapratīkā nabhaso netyā ||
Translation: She climbed her servant's chariot, she like Sūrya with cloud-like motion and refulgent aspect.

Sanskit Text: आस्थापयन्त युवतिं युवानः शुभे निमिष्लां विदथेषुपज्राम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsthāpayanta yuvatiṃ yuvānaḥ śubhe nimiṣlāṃ vidatheṣupajrām |
Translation: 6 Upon their car the young men set the Maiden wedded to glory, mighty in assemblies,

Sanskit Text: अर्को यद वो मरुतो हविष्मान गायद गाथं सुतसोमो दुवस्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arko yad vo maruto haviṣmān ghāyad ghāthaṃ sutasomo duvasyan ||
Translation: When your song, Maruts, rose, and, with oblation, the Soma-pourer sang his hymn in worship.

Sanskit Text: परतं विवक्मि वक्म्यो य एषां मरुतां महिमा सत्यो अस्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prataṃ vivakmi vakmyo ya eṣāṃ marutāṃ mahimā satyo asti |
Translation: 7 I will declare the greatness of these Maruts, their real greatness, worthy to be lauded,

Sanskit Text: सचा यदीं वर्षमणा अहंयु सथिरा चिज्जनीर्वहते सुभागाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sacā yadīṃ vṛṣamaṇā ahaṃyu sthirā cijjanīrvahate subhāghāḥ ||
Translation: How, with them, she though firm, strong-minded, haughty, travels to women happy in their fortune.

Sanskit Text: पान्ति मित्रावरुणाववद्याच्चयत ईमर्यमो अप्रशस्तान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pānti mitrāvaruṇāvavadyāccayata īmaryamo apraśastān |
Translation: 8 Mitra and Varuṇa they guard from censure: Aryaman too, discovers worthless sinners Firm things are overthrown that ne’er were shaken: he prospers, Maruts, who gives choice oblations.

Sanskit Text: उत चयवन्ते अच्युता धरुवाणि वाव्र्ध ईं मरुतो दातिवारः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta cyavante acyutā dhruvāṇi vāvṛdha īṃ maruto dātivāraḥ ||
Translation: 9 None of us, Maruts, near or at a distance, hath ever reached the limit of your vigour.

Sanskit Text: नही नु वो मरुतो अन्त्यस्मे आरात्ताच्चिच्छवसो अन्तमापुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahī nu vo maruto antyasme ārāttāccicchavaso antamāpuḥ |
Translation: They in courageous might still waxing boldly have compassed round their foemen like an ocean.

Sanskit Text: ते धर्ष्णुना शवसा शूशुवांसो.अर्णो न दवेषो धर्षता परि षठुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te dhṛṣṇunā śavasā śūśuvāṃso.arṇo na dveṣo dhṛṣatā pari ṣṭhuḥ ||
Translation: 10 May we this day be dearest friends of Indra, and let us call on him in fight to-morrow.

Sanskit Text: वयमद्येन्द्रस्य परेष्ठा वयं शवो वोचेमहि समर्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayamadyendrasya preṣṭhā vayaṃ śvo vocemahi samarye |
Translation: So were we erst. New might attend us daily! So be with us! Ṛbhukṣan of the Heroes!

Sanskit Text: वयं पुरा महि च नो अनु दयून तन न रभुक्षा नरामनु षयात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ purā mahi ca no anu dyūn tan na ṛbhukṣā narāmanu ṣyāt ||
Translation: 11 May this your laud, may this your song, O Maruts, sung by the poet, Māna's son, Māndārya,

Sanskit Text: एष व सतोमो ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa va stomo ... ||
Translation: Bring offspring for ourselves with. food to feed us. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

Sanskit Text: महश्चित तवमिन्द्र यत एतान महश्चिदसि तयजसो वरूता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahaścit tvamindra yata etān mahaścidasi tyajaso varūtā |
Translation: 1. As, Indra, from great treason thou protectest, yea, from great treachery these who approach us,

Sanskit Text: स नो वेधो मरुतां चिकित्वान सुम्ना वनुष्व तव हि परेष्ठा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no vedho marutāṃ cikitvān sumnā vanuṣva tava hi preṣṭhā ||
Translation: So, marking well, Controller of the Maruts grant us their blessings, for they are thy dearest.

Sanskit Text: अयुज्रन त इन्द्र विश्वक्र्ष्टीर्विदानासो निष्षिधो मर्त्यत्रा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayujran ta indra viśvakṛṣṭīrvidānāso niṣṣidho martyatrā |
Translation: 2 The various doings of all mortal people by thee are ordered, in thy wisdom, Indra.

Sanskit Text: मरुतां पर्त्सुतिर्हासमाना सवर्मीळ्हस्य परधनस्य सातौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: marutāṃ pṛtsutirhāsamānā svarmīḷhasya pradhanasya sātau ||
Translation: The host of Maruts goeth forth exulting to win the light-bestowing spoil of battle.

Sanskit Text: अम्यक सा त इन्द्र रष्टिरस्मे सनेम्यभ्वं मरुतो जुनन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: amyak sā ta indra ṛṣṭirasme sanemyabhvaṃ maruto junanti |
Translation: 3 That spear of thine sat firm for us, O Indra: the Maruts set their whole dread power in motion.

Sanskit Text: अग्निश्चिद धि षमातसे शुशुक्वानापो न दवीपं दधतिप्रयांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniścid dhi ṣmātase śuśukvānāpo na dvīpaṃ dadhatiprayāṃsi ||
Translation: E’en Agni shines resplendent in the brush-wood: the viands hold him as floods hold an island.

Sanskit Text: तवं तू न इन्द्र तं रयिं दा ओजिष्ठया दक्षिणयेव रातिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tū na indra taṃ rayiṃ dā ojiṣṭhayā dakṣiṇayeva rātim |
Translation: 4 Vouchsafe us now that opulence, O Indra, as guerdon won by mightiest donation.

Sanskit Text: सतुतश्च यास्ते चकनन्त वायो सतनं न मध्वःपीपयन्त वाजैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stutaśca yāste cakananta vāyo stanaṃ na madhvaḥpīpayanta vājaiḥ ||
Translation: May hymns that please thee cause the breast of Vāyu to swell as with the mead's refreshing sweetness.

Sanskit Text: तवे राय इन्द्र तोशतमाः परणेतारः कस्य चिद रतायोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve rāya indra tośatamāḥ praṇetāraḥ kasya cid ṛtāyoḥ |
Translation: 5 With thee, O Indra, are most bounteous riches that further every one who lives uprightly.

Sanskit Text: ते षु णो मरुतो मर्ळयन्तु ये समा पुरा गातूयन्तीव देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te ṣu ṇo maruto mṛḷayantu ye smā purā ghātūyantīva devāḥ ||
Translation: Now may these Maruts show us loving-kindness, Gods who of old were ever prompt to help us.

Sanskit Text: परति पर याहीन्द्र मीळ्हुषो नॄन महः पार्थिवे सदने यतस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati pra yāhīndra mīḷhuṣo nṝn mahaḥ pārthive sadane yatasva |
Translation: 6 Bring forth the Men who rain down boons, O Indra: exert thee in the great terrestrial region;

Sanskit Text: अध यदेषां पर्थुबुध्नास एतास्तीर्थे नार्यः पौंस्यानि तस्थुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha yadeṣāṃ pṛthubudhnāsa etāstīrthe nāryaḥ pauṃsyāni tasthuḥ ||
Translation: For their broad-chested speckled deer are standing like a King's armies on the field of battle.

Sanskit Text: परति घोराणामेतानामयासां मरुतां शर्ण्व आयतामुपब्दिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati ghorāṇāmetānāmayāsāṃ marutāṃ śṛṇva āyatāmupabdiḥ |
Translation: 7 Heard is the roar of the advancing Maruts, terrific, glittering, and swiftly moving,

Sanskit Text: ये मर्त्यं पर्तनायन्तमूमैर्र्णावानं न पतयन्त सर्गैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye martyaṃ pṛtanāyantamūmairṛṇāvānaṃ na patayanta sarghaiḥ ||
Translation: Who with their rush o’erthrow as ’twere a sinner the mortal who would fight with those who love him

Sanskit Text: तवं मानेभ्य इन्द्र विश्वजन्या रदा मरुद्भिः शुरुधो गोग्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ mānebhya indra viśvajanyā radā marudbhiḥ śurudho ghoaghrāḥ |
Translation: 8 Give to the Mānas, Indra with Maruts, gifts universal, gifts of cattle foremost.

Sanskit Text: सतवानेभि सतवसे देव देवैर्विद्यामेषं वर्जनं जीरदानुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stavānebhi stavase deva devairvidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum ||
Translation: Thou, God, art praised with Gods who must be lauded. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

Sanskit Text: न नूनमस्ति नो शवः कस्तद वेद यदद्भुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na nūnamasti no śvaḥ kastad veda yadadbhutam |
Translation: 1. NAUGHT is to-day, to-morrow naught. Who comprehends the mystery?

Sanskit Text: अन्यस्यचित्तमभि संचरेण्यमुताधीतं वि नश्यति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anyasyacittamabhi saṃcareṇyamutādhītaṃ vi naśyati ||
Translation: We must address ourselves unto another's thought, and lost is then the hope we formed.

Sanskit Text: किं न इन्द्र जिघांससि भरातरो मरुतस्तव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kiṃ na indra jighāṃsasi bhrātaro marutastava |
Translation: 2 The Maruts are thy brothers. Why, O Indra, wouldst thou take our lives?

Sanskit Text: तेभिः कल्पस्व साधुया मा नः समरणे वधीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tebhiḥ kalpasva sādhuyā mā naḥ samaraṇe vadhīḥ ||
Translation: Agree with them in friendly wise, and do not slay us in the fight.

Sanskit Text: किं नो भरातरगस्त्य सखा सन्नति मन्यसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kiṃ no bhrātaraghastya sakhā sannati manyase |
Translation: 3 Agastya, brother, why dost thou neglect us, thou who art our friend?

Sanskit Text: विद्मा हि तेयथा मनो.अस्मभ्यमिन न दित्ससि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidmā hi teyathā mano.asmabhyamin na ditsasi ||
Translation: We know the nature of thy mind. Verity thou wilt give us naught.

Sanskit Text: अरं कर्ण्वन्तु वेदिं समग्निमिन्धतां पुरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: araṃ kṛṇvantu vediṃ samaghnimindhatāṃ puraḥ |
Translation: 4 Let them prepare the altar, let them kindle fire in front: we two

Sanskit Text: तत्राम्र्तस्य चेतनं यज्ञं ते तनवावहै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tatrāmṛtasya cetanaṃ yajñaṃ te tanavāvahai ||
Translation: Here will spread sacrifice for thee, that the Immortal may observe.

Sanskit Text: तवमीशिषे वसुपते वसूनां तवं मित्राणां मित्रपते धेष्ठः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamīśiṣe vasupate vasūnāṃ tvaṃ mitrāṇāṃ mitrapate dheṣṭhaḥ |
Translation: 5 Thou, Lord of Wealth, art Master of all treasures, thou, Lord of friends, art thy friends' best supporter.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र तवं मरुद्भिः सं वदस्वाध पराशान रतुथा हवींषि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra tvaṃ marudbhiḥ saṃ vadasvādha prāśāna ṛtuthā havīṃṣi ||
Translation: O Indra, speak thou kindly with the Maruts, and taste oblations in their proper season.

Sanskit Text: परति व एना नमसाहमेमि सूक्तेन भिक्षे सुमतिं तुराणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati va enā namasāhamemi sūktena bhikṣe sumatiṃ turāṇām |
Translation: 1. To you I come with this mine adoration, and with a hymn I crave the Strong Ones' favour

Sanskit Text: रराणता मरुतो वेद्याभिर्नि हेळो धत्त वि मुचध्वमश्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rarāṇatā maruto vedyābhirni heḷo dhatta vi mucadhvamaśvān ||
Translation: A hymn that truly makes you joyful, Maruts. Suppress your anger and unyoke your horses.

Sanskit Text: एष व सतोमो मरुतो नमस्वान हर्दा तष्टो मनसा धायि देवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa va stomo maruto namasvān hṛdā taṣṭo manasā dhāyi devāḥ |
Translation: 2 Maruts, to you this laud with prayer and worship, formed in the mind and heart, ye Gods, is offered.

Sanskit Text: उपेमा यात मनसा जुषाणा यूयं हि षठा नमस इद वर्धासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upemā yāta manasā juṣāṇā yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā namasa id vṛdhāsaḥ ||
Translation: Come ye to us, rejoicing in your spirit, for ye are they who make our prayer effective.

Sanskit Text: सतुतासो नो मरुतो मर्ळयन्तूत सतुतो मघवा शमभविष्ठः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stutāso no maruto mṛḷayantūta stuto maghavā śambhaviṣṭhaḥ |
Translation: 3 The Maruts, praised by us, shall show us favour; Maghavan, lauded, shall be most propitious.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वा नः सन्तु कोम्या वनान्यहानि विश्वा मरुतो जिगीषा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvā naḥ santu komyā vanānyahāni viśvā maruto jighīṣā ||
Translation: Maruts,, may all our days that are to follow be very pleasant, lovely and triumphant.

Sanskit Text: अस्मादहं तविषादीषमाण इन्द्राद भिया मरुतो रेजमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmādahaṃ taviṣādīṣamāṇa indrād bhiyā maruto rejamānaḥ |
Translation: 4 I fled in

Sanskit Text: <a href="errata.htm#6">
terror
from this mighty Indra, my body trembling in alarm, O Maruts.
युष्मभ्यं हव्या निशितान्यासन तान्यारे चक्र्मा मर्ळत नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmabhyaṃ havyā niśitānyāsan tānyāre cakṛmā mṛḷata naḥ ||
Translation: Oblations meant for you had been made ready; these have we set aside: for this forgive us.

Sanskit Text: येन मानासश्चितयन्त उस्रा वयुष्टिषु शवसा शश्वतीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena mānāsaścitayanta usrā vyuṣṭiṣu śavasā śaśvatīnām |
Translation: 5 By whom the Mānas recognize the day-springs, by whose strength at the dawn of endless mornings,

Sanskit Text: स नो मरुद्भिर्व्र्षभ शरवो धा उग्र उग्रेभि सथविरः सहोदाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no marudbhirvṛṣabha śravo dhā ughra ughrebhi sthaviraḥ sahodāḥ ||
Translation: Give us, thou Mighty, glory with Maruts. fierce with the fierce, the Strong who givest triumph.

Sanskit Text: तवं पाहीन्द्र सहीयसो नॄन भवा मरुद्भिरवयातहेळाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ pāhīndra sahīyaso nṝn bhavā marudbhiravayātaheḷāḥ |
Translation: 6 Do thou, O Indra, guard the conquering Heroes, and rid thee of thy wrath against the Maruts,

Sanskit Text: सुप्रकेतेभिः सासहिर्दधानो विद्यामेषं व. ज. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: supraketebhiḥ sāsahirdadhāno vidyāmeṣaṃ v. j. ||
Translation: With them, the wise, victorious and bestowing. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

Sanskit Text: चित्रो वो.अस्तु यामश्चित्र ऊती सुदानवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: citro vo.astu yāmaścitra ūtī sudānavaḥ |
Translation: 1. WONDERFUL let your coming be, wondrous with help, ye Bounteous Ones,

Sanskit Text: मरुतो अहिभानवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maruto ahibhānavaḥ ||
Translation: Maruts, who gleam as serpents gleam.

Sanskit Text: आरे सा वः सुदानवो मरुत रञ्जती शरुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āre sā vaḥ sudānavo maruta ṛñjatī śaruḥ |
Translation: 2 Far be from us, O Maruts, ye free givers, your impetuous shaft;

Sanskit Text: आरे अश्मा यमस्यथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āre aśmā yamasyatha ||
Translation: Far from us be the stone ye hurl.

Sanskit Text: तर्णस्कन्दस्य नु विशः परि वर्ङकत सुदानवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tṛṇaskandasya nu viśaḥ pari vṛṅkta sudānavaḥ |
Translation: 3 O Bounteous Givers, touch ye not, O Maruts, Tṛṇskanda's folk;

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वान नः कर्त जीवसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvān naḥ karta jīvase ||
Translation: Lift ye us up that we may live.

Sanskit Text: गायत साम नभन्यं यथा वेरर्चाम तद वाव्र्धानं सवर्वत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāyat sāma nabhanyaṃ yathā verarcāma tad vāvṛdhānaṃ svarvat |
Translation: 1. THE praise-song let him sing forth bursting bird-like: sing we that hymn which like heaven's light expandeth,

Sanskit Text: गावो धेनवो बर्हिष्यदब्धा आ यत सद्मानं दिव्यं विवासान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāvo dhenavo barhiṣyadabdhā ā yat sadmānaṃ divyaṃ vivāsān ||
Translation: That the milk-giving cows may, unimpeded call to the sacred grass the Gods’ assembly.

Sanskit Text: अर्चद वर्षा वर्षभिः सवेदुहव्यैर्म्र्गो नाश्नो अति यज्जुगुर्यात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arcad vṛṣā vṛṣabhiḥ sveduhavyairmṛgho nāśno ati yajjughuryāt |
Translation: 2 Let the Bull sing with Bulls whose toil is worship, with a loud roar like some wild beast that hungers.

Sanskit Text: पर मन्दयुर्मनां गूर्त होता भरते मर्यो मिथुना यजत्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra mandayurmanāṃ ghūrta hotā bharate maryo mithunā yajatraḥ ||
Translation: Praised God! the glad priest brings his heart's devotion; the holy youth presents twofold oblation.

Sanskit Text: नक्षद धोता परि सद्म मिता यन भरद गर्भमा शरदः पर्थिव्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nakṣad dhotā pari sadma mitā yan bharad gharbhamā śaradaḥ pṛthivyāḥ |
Translation: 3 May the Priest come circling the measured stations, and with him bring the earth's autumnal fruitage.

Sanskit Text: करन्ददश्वो नयमानो रुवद गौरन्तर्दूतो न रोदसी चरद वाक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: krandadaśvo nayamāno ruvad ghaurantardūto na rodasī carad vāk ||
Translation: Let the Horse neigh led near, let the Steer bellow: let the Voice go between both worlds as herald,

Sanskit Text: ता कर्माषतरास्मै पर चयौत्नानि देवयन्तो भरन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā karmāṣatarāsmai pra cyautnāni devayanto bharante |
Translation: 4 To him we offer welcomest oblations, the pious bring their strength-inspiring praises.

Sanskit Text: जुजोषदिन्द्रो दस्मवर्चा नासत्येव सुग्म्यो रथेष्ठाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jujoṣadindro dasmavarcā nāsatyeva sughmyo ratheṣṭhāḥ ||
Translation: May Indra, wondrous in his might, accept them, car-borne and swift to move like the Nāsatyas.

Sanskit Text: तमु षटुहीन्द्रं यो ह सत्वा यः शूरो मघवा यो रथेष्ठाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamu ṣṭuhīndraṃ yo ha satvā yaḥ śūro maghavā yo ratheṣṭhāḥ |
Translation: 5 Praise thou that Indra who is truly mighty, the car-borne Warrior, Maghavan the Hero;

Sanskit Text: परतीचश्चिद योधीयान वर्षण्वान ववव्रुषश्चित तमसो विहन्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratīcaścid yodhīyān vṛṣaṇvān vavavruṣaścit tamaso vihantā ||
Translation: Stronger in war than those who fight against him, borne by strong steeds, who kills enclosing darkness;

Sanskit Text: पर यदित्था महिना नर्भ्यो अस्त्यरं रोदसी कक्ष्ये नास्मै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yaditthā mahinā nṛbhyo astyaraṃ rodasī kakṣye nāsmai |
Translation: 6 Him who surpasses heroes in his greatness: the earth and heavens suffice not for his girdles.

Sanskit Text: सं विव्य इन्द्रो वर्जनं न भूमा भर्ति सवधावानोपशमिव दयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ vivya indro vṛjanaṃ na bhūmā bharti svadhāvānopaśamiva dyām ||
Translation: Indra endues the earth to be his garment, and, God-like, wears the heaven as ’twere a frontlet,

Sanskit Text: समत्सु तवा शूर सतामुराणं परपथिन्तमं परितंसयध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samatsu tvā śūra satāmurāṇaṃ prapathintamaṃ paritaṃsayadhyai |
Translation: 7 Thee, Hero, guardian of the brave in battles, who roamest in the van,—to draw thee hither,

Sanskit Text: सजोषस इन्द्रं मदे कषोणीः सूरिं चिद ये अनुमदन्ति वाजैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasa indraṃ made kṣoṇīḥ sūriṃ cid ye anumadanti vājaiḥ ||
Translation: Indra, the hosts agree beside the Soma, and joy, for his great actions, in the Chieftain.

Sanskit Text: एवा हि ते शं सवना समुद्र आपो यत त आसु मदन्ति देवीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā hi te śaṃ savanā samudra āpo yat ta āsu madanti devīḥ |
Translation: 8 Libations in the sea to thee are pleasant, when thy divine Floods come to cheer these people.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा ते अनु जोष्या भूद गौः सूरींश्चिद यदि धिषा वेषि जनान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā te anu joṣyā bhūd ghauḥ sūrīṃścid yadi dhiṣā veṣi janān ||
Translation: To thee the Cow is sum of all things grateful when with the wish thou seekest men and princes.

Sanskit Text: असाम यथा सुषखाय एन सवभिष्टयो नरां न शंसैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asāma yathā suṣakhāya ena svabhiṣṭayo narāṃ na śaṃsaiḥ |
Translation: 9 So may we in this One be well befriended, well aided as it were through praise of chieftains,

Sanskit Text: असद यथा न इन्द्रो वन्दनेष्ठास्तुरो न कर्म नयमान उक्था ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asad yathā na indro vandaneṣṭhāsturo na karma nayamāna ukthā ||
Translation: That Indra still may linger at our worship, as one led swift to work, to hear our praises.

Sanskit Text: विष्पर्धसो नरां न शंसैरस्माकासदिन्द्रो वज्रहस्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viṣpardhaso narāṃ na śaṃsairasmākāsadindro vajrahastaḥ |
Translation: 10 Like men in rivalry extolling princes, our Friend be Indra, wielder of the thunder.

Sanskit Text: मित्रायुवो न पूर्पतिं सुशिष्टौ मध्यायुव उप शिक्षन्ति यज्ञैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitrāyuvo na pūrpatiṃ suśiṣṭau madhyāyuva upa śikṣanti yajñaiḥ ||
Translation: Like true friends of some city's lord within them held in good rule with sacrifice they help him.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञो हि षमेन्द्रं कश्चिद रन्धञ जुहुराणश्चिन मनसापरियन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajño hi ṣmendraṃ kaścid ṛndhañ juhurāṇaścin manasāpariyan |
Translation: 11 For every sacrifice makes Indra stronger, yea, when he goes around angry in spirit;

Sanskit Text: तीर्थे नाछा तात्र्षाणमोको दीर्घो न सिध्रमा कर्णोत्यध्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tīrthe nāchā tātṛṣāṇamoko dīrgho na sidhramā kṛṇotyadhvā ||
Translation: As pleasure at the ford invites the thirsty, as the long way brings him who gains his object.

Sanskit Text: मो षू ण इन्द्रात्र पर्त्सु देवैरस्ति हि षमा ते शुष्मिन्नवयाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mo ṣū ṇa indrātra pṛtsu devairasti hi ṣmā te śuṣminnavayāḥ |
Translation: 12 Let us not here contend with Gods, O Indra, for here, O Mighty One, is thine own portion,

Sanskit Text: महश्चिद यस्य मीळ्हुषो यव्या हविष्मतो मरुतोवन्दते गीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahaścid yasya mīḷhuṣo yavyā haviṣmato marutovandate ghīḥ ||
Translation: The Great, whose Friends the bounteous Maruts honour, as with a stream, his song who pours oblations.

Sanskit Text: एष सतोम इन्द्र तुभ्यमस्मे एतेन गातुं हरिवो विदो नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa stoma indra tubhyamasme etena ghātuṃ harivo vido naḥ |
Translation: 13 Addressed to thee is this our praise, O Indra: Lord of Bay Steeds, find us hereby advancement.

Sanskit Text: आ नो वव्र्त्याः सुविताय देव विद्यामेषं व. ज. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no vavṛtyāḥ suvitāya deva vidyāmeṣaṃ v. j. ||
Translation: So mayst thou lead us on, O God, to comfort. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

Sanskit Text: तवं राजेन्द्र ये च देवा रक्षा नॄन पाह्यसुर तवमस्मान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ rājendra ye ca devā rakṣā nṝn pāhyasura tvamasmān |
Translation: 1. THOU art the King of all the Gods, O Indra: protect the men, O Asura, preserve us.

Sanskit Text: तवं सत्पतिर्मघवा नस्तरुत्रस्त्वं सत्यो वसवानः सहोदाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ satpatirmaghavā nastarutrastvaṃ satyo vasavānaḥ sahodāḥ ||
Translation: Thou Lord of Heroes, Maghavan, our saver, art faithful, very rich, the victory-giver.

Sanskit Text: दनो विश इन्द्र मर्ध्रवाचः सप्त यत पुरः शर्म शारदीर्दर्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dano viśa indra mṛdhravācaḥ sapta yat puraḥ śarma śāradīrdart |
Translation: 2 Indra, thou humbledst tribes that spake with insult by breaking down seven autumn forts, their refuge.

Sanskit Text: रणोरपो अनवद्यार्णा यूने वर्त्रं पुरुकुत्साय रन्धीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṇorapo anavadyārṇā yūne vṛtraṃ purukutsāya randhīḥ ||
Translation: Thou stirredst, Blameless! billowy floods, and gavest his foe a prey to youthful Purukutsa.

Sanskit Text: अजा वर्त इन्द्र शूरपत्नीर्द्यां च येभिः पुरुहूत नूनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajā vṛta indra śūrapatnīrdyāṃ ca yebhiḥ puruhūta nūnam |
Translation: 3 With whom thou drivest troops whose lords are heroes, and bringest daylight now, much worshipped Indra,

Sanskit Text: रक्षो अग्निमशुषं तूर्वयाणं सिंहो न दमे अपांसि वस्तोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rakṣo aghnimaśuṣaṃ tūrvayāṇaṃ siṃho na dame apāṃsi vastoḥ ||
Translation: With them guard lion-like wasting active Agni to dwell in our tilled fields and in our homestead.

Sanskit Text: शेषन नु त इन्द्र सस्मिन योनौ परशस्तये पवीरवस्य मह्ना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śeṣan nu ta indra sasmin yonau praśastaye pavīravasya mahnā |
