Translation: 4 They through the greatness of thy spear, O Indra, shall, to thy praise, rest in this earthly station.

Sanskit Text: सर्जदर्णांस्यव यद युधा गास्तिष्ठद धरी धर्षता मर्ष्ट वाजान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sṛjadarṇāṃsyava yad yudhā ghāstiṣṭhad dharī dhṛṣatā mṛṣṭa vājān ||
Translation: To loose the floods, to seek, for kine, the battle, his Bays he mounted boldly seized the booty.

Sanskit Text: वह कुत्समिन्द्र यस्मिञ्चाकन सयूमन्यू रज्रा वातस्याश्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaha kutsamindra yasmiñcākan syūmanyū ṛjrā vātasyāśvā |
Translation: 5 Indra, bear Kutsa, him in whom thou joyest: the dark-red horses of the Wind are docile.

Sanskit Text: पर सूरश्चक्रं वर्हतादभीके.अभि सप्र्धो यासिषद्वज्रबाहुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sūraścakraṃ vṛhatādabhīke.abhi spṛdho yāsiṣadvajrabāhuḥ ||
Translation: Let the Sun roll his chariot wheel anear us, and let the Thunderer go to meet the foemen.

Sanskit Text: जघन्वानिन्द्र मित्रेरूञ्चोदप्रव्र्द्धो हरिवो अदाशून |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jaghanvānindra mitrerūñcodapravṛddho harivo adāśūn |
Translation: 6 Thou Indra, Lord of Bays, made strong by impulse, hast slain the vexers of thy friends, who give not.

Sanskit Text: परये पश्यन्नर्यमणं सचायोस्त्वया शूर्ता वहमाना अपत्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: praye paśyannaryamaṇaṃ sacāyostvayā śūrtā vahamānā apatyam ||
Translation: They who beheld the Friend beside the living were cast aside by thee as they rode onward.

Sanskit Text: रपत कविरिन्द्रार्कसातौ कषां दासायोपबर्हणीं कः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rapat kavirindrārkasātau kṣāṃ dāsāyopabarhaṇīṃ kaḥ |
Translation: 7 Indra, the bard sang forth in inspiration: thou madest earth a covering for the Dāsa.

Sanskit Text: करत तिस्रो मघवा दानुचित्रा नि दुर्योणे कुयवाचं मर्धिश्रेत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: karat tisro maghavā dānucitrā ni duryoṇe kuyavācaṃ mṛdhiśret ||
Translation: Maghavan made the three that gleam with moisture, and to his home brought Kuyavāc to slay him.

Sanskit Text: सना ता त इन्द्र नव्या आगुः सहो नभो.अविरणाय पूर्वीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanā tā ta indra navyā āghuḥ saho nabho.aviraṇāya pūrvīḥ |
Translation: 8 These thine old deeds new bards have sung, O Indra. Thou conqueredst, boundest many tribes for ever.

Sanskit Text: भिनत पुरो न भिदो अदेवीर्ननमो वधरदेवस्य पीयोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhinat puro na bhido adevīrnanamo vadharadevasya pīyoḥ ||
Translation: Like castles thou hast crushed the godless races, and bowed the godless scorner's deadly weapon.

Sanskit Text: तवं धुनिरिन्द्र धुनिमतीर्र्णोरपः सीरा न सरवन्तीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ dhunirindra dhunimatīrṛṇorapaḥ sīrā na sravantīḥ |
Translation: 9 A Stormer thou hast made the stormy waters flow down, O Indra, like the running rivers.

Sanskit Text: पर यत समुद्रमति शूर पर्षि पारया तुर्वशं यदुं सवस्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yat samudramati śūra parṣi pārayā turvaśaṃ yaduṃ svasti ||
Translation: When o’er the flood thou broughtest them, O Hero, thou keptest Turvaśa and Yadu safely.

Sanskit Text: तवमस्माकमिन्द्र विश्वध सय अव्र्कतमो नरां नर्पाता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamasmākamindra viśvadha sya avṛkatamo narāṃ nṛpātā |
Translation: 10 Indra, mayst thou be ours in all occasions, protector of the men, most gentle-hearted,

Sanskit Text: स नो विश्वासां सप्र्धां सहोदा वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no viśvāsāṃ spṛdhāṃ sahodā vi... ||
Translation: Giving us victory over all our rivals. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

Sanskit Text: मत्स्यपायि ते महः पात्रस्येव हरिवो मत्सरो मदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: matsyapāyi te mahaḥ pātrasyeva harivo matsaro madaḥ |
Translation: 1. GLAD thee: thy glory hath been quaffed, Lord of Bay Steeds, as ’twere the bowl's enlivening mead.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा ते वर्ष्ण इन्दुर्वाजी सहस्रसातमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā te vṛṣṇa indurvājī sahasrasātamaḥ ||
Translation: For thee the Strong there is strong drink, mighty, omnipotent to win.

Sanskit Text: आ नस्ते गन्तु मत्सरो वर्षा मदो वरेण्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā naste ghantu matsaro vṛṣā mado vareṇyaḥ |
Translation: 2 Let our strong drink, most excellent, exhilarating, come to thee,

Sanskit Text: सहावानिन्द्रसानसिः पर्तनाषाळ अमर्त्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahāvānindrasānasiḥ pṛtanāṣāḷ amartyaḥ ||
Translation: Victorious, Indra! bringing gain, immortal conquering in fight,

Sanskit Text: तवं हि शूरः सनिता चोदयो मनुषो रथम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hi śūraḥ sanitā codayo manuṣo ratham |
Translation: 3 Thou, Hero, winner of the spoil, urgest to speed the car of man.

Sanskit Text: सहावान दस्युमव्रतमोषः पात्रं न शोचिषा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahāvān dasyumavratamoṣaḥ pātraṃ na śociṣā ||
Translation: Burn, like a vessel with the flame, the lawless Dasyu, Conqueror!

Sanskit Text: मुषाय सुर्यं कवे चक्रमीशान ओजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: muṣāya suryaṃ kave cakramīśāna ojasā |
Translation: 4 Empowered by thine own might, O Sage, thou stolest Sūrya's chariot wheel.

Sanskit Text: वह शुष्णायवधं कुत्सं वातस्याश्वैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaha śuṣṇāyavadhaṃ kutsaṃ vātasyāśvaiḥ ||
Translation: Thou barest Kutsa with the steeds of Wind to Śuṣṇa as his death.

Sanskit Text: शुष्मिन्तमो हि ते मदो दयुम्निन्तम उत करतुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuṣmintamo hi te mado dyumnintama uta kratuḥ |
Translation: 5 Most mighty is thy rapturous joy, most splendid is thine active power,

Sanskit Text: वर्त्रघ्ना वरिवोविदा मंसीष्ठा अश्वसातमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛtraghnā varivovidā maṃsīṣṭhā aśvasātamaḥ ||
Translation: Wherewith, foe-slaying, sending bliss, thou art supreme in gaining steeds.

Sanskit Text: यथा पुर्वेभ्यो जरित्र्भ्य इन्द्र मय इवापो न तर्ष्यते बभूथ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā purvebhyo jaritṛbhya indra maya ivāpo na tṛṣyate babhūtha |
Translation: 6 As thou, O Indra, to the ancient singers wast ever joy, as water to the thirsty,

Sanskit Text: तामनु तवा निविदं जोहवीमि वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāmanu tvā nividaṃ johavīmi vi... ||
Translation: So unto thee I sing this invocation. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

Sanskit Text: आ चर्षणिप्रा वर्षभो जनानां राजा कर्ष्टीनां पुरुहूत इन्द्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā carṣaṇiprā vṛṣabho janānāṃ rājā kṛṣṭīnāṃ puruhūta indraḥ |
Translation: 1. THE Bull of men, who cherishes all people, King of the Races, Indra, called of many,

Sanskit Text: सतुतः शरवस्यन्नवसोप मद्रिग युक्त्वा हरीव्र्षणा याह्यर्वां ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stutaḥ śravasyannavasopa madrigh yuktvā harīvṛṣaṇā yāhyarvāṃ ||
Translation: Fame-loving, praised, hither to me with succour turn having yoked both vigorous Bay Horses!

Sanskit Text: ये ते वर्षणो वर्षभास इन्द्र बरह्मयुजो वर्षरथासो अत्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye te vṛṣaṇo vṛṣabhāsa indra brahmayujo vṛṣarathāso atyāḥ |
Translation: 2 Thy mighty Stallions, yoked by prayer, O Indra, thy. Coursers to thy mighty chariot harnessed,—

Sanskit Text: ताना तिष्ठ तेभिरा याह्यर्वां हवामहे तवा सुत इन्द्र सोमे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tānā tiṣṭha tebhirā yāhyarvāṃ havāmahe tvā suta indra some ||
Translation: Ascend thou these, and borne by them come hither: with Soma juice outpoured, Indra, we call thee.

Sanskit Text: आ तिष्ठ रथं वर्षणं वर्षा ते सुतः सोमः परिषिक्ता मधूनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tiṣṭha rathaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vṛṣā te sutaḥ somaḥ pariṣiktā madhūni |
Translation: 3 Ascend thy mighty car: the mighty Soma is poured for thee and sweets are sprinkled round us.

Sanskit Text: युक्त्वा वर्षभ्यां वर्षभ कषितीनां हरिभ्यां याहि परवतोप मद्रिक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuktvā vṛṣabhyāṃ vṛṣabha kṣitīnāṃ haribhyāṃ yāhi pravatopa madrik ||
Translation: Come down to us-ward, Bull of human races, come, having harnessed them, with strong Bay Horses.

Sanskit Text: अयं यज्ञो देवया अयं मियेध इमा बरह्मण्ययमिन्द्र सोमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ yajño devayā ayaṃ miyedha imā brahmaṇyayamindra somaḥ |
Translation: 4 Here is God-reaching sacrifice, here the victim; here, Indra, are the prayers, here is the Soma.

Sanskit Text: सतीर्णं बर्हिरा तु शक्र पर याहि पिबा निषद्यवि मुचा हरी इह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stīrṇaṃ barhirā tu śakra pra yāhi pibā niṣadyavi mucā harī iha ||
Translation: Strewn is the sacred grass: come hither, Śakra; seat thee and drink: unyoke thy two Bay Coursers.

Sanskit Text: ओ सुष्टुत इन्द्र याह्यर्वां उप बरह्माणि मान्यस्य कारोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: o suṣṭuta indra yāhyarvāṃ upa brahmāṇi mānyasya kāroḥ |
Translation: 5 Come to us, Indra, come thou highly lauded to the devotions of the singer Māna.

Sanskit Text: विद्याम वस्तोरवसा गर्णन्तो वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidyāma vastoravasā ghṛṇanto vi... ||
Translation: Singing, may we find early through thy succour, may we find strengthening food in full abundance.

Sanskit Text: यद ध सया त इन्द्र शरुष्टिरस्ति यया बभूथ जरित्र्भ्य ऊती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad dha syā ta indra śruṣṭirasti yayā babhūtha jaritṛbhya ūtī |
Translation: 1. IF, Indra, thou hast given that gracious hearing where with thou helpest those who sang thy praises.

Sanskit Text: मा नः कामं महयन्तमा धग विश्वा ते अश्याम्पर्याप आयोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā naḥ kāmaṃ mahayantamā dhagh viśvā te aśyāmparyāpa āyoḥ ||
Translation: Blast not the wish that would exalt us may I gain all from thee, and pay all man's devotions.

Sanskit Text: न घा राजेन्द्र आ दभन नो या नु सवसारा कर्णवन्त योनौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na ghā rājendra ā dabhan no yā nu svasārā kṛṇavanta yonau |
Translation: 2 Let not the Sovran Indra disappoint us in what shall bring both Sisters to our dwelling.

Sanskit Text: आपश्चिदस्मै सुतुका अवेषन गमन न इन्द्रः सख्या वयश्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpaścidasmai sutukā aveṣan ghaman na indraḥ sakhyā vayaśca ||
Translation: To him have run the quickly flowing waters. May Indra come to us with life and friendship.

Sanskit Text: जेता नर्भिरिन्द्रः पर्त्सु शूरः शरोता हवं नाधमानस्य कारोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jetā nṛbhirindraḥ pṛtsu śūraḥ śrotā havaṃ nādhamānasya kāroḥ |
Translation: 3 Victorious with the men, Hero in battles, Indra, who hears the singer's supplication,

Sanskit Text: परभर्ता रथं दाशुष उपक उद्यन्त गिरो यदि च तमना भूत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prabhartā rathaṃ dāśuṣa upaka udyanta ghiro yadi ca tmanā bhūt ||
Translation: Will bring his car nigh to the man who offers, if he himself upholds the songs that praise him.

Sanskit Text: एवा नर्भिरिन्द्रः सुश्रवस्या परखादः पर्क्षो अभि मित्रिणो भूत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā nṛbhirindraḥ suśravasyā prakhādaḥ pṛkṣo abhi mitriṇo bhūt |
Translation: 4 Yea, Indra, with the men, through love of glory consumes the sacred food which friends have offered.

Sanskit Text: समर्य इष सतवते विवाचि सत्राकरो यजमानस्यशंसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samarya iṣa stavate vivāci satrākaro yajamānasyaśaṃsaḥ ||
Translation: The ever-strengthening song of him who worships is sung in fight amid the clash of voices.

Sanskit Text: तवया वयं मघवन्निन्द्र शत्रुनभि षयम महतो मन्यमनान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā vayaṃ maghavannindra śatrunabhi ṣyama mahato manyamanān |
Translation: 5 Aided by thee, O Maghavan, O Indra, may we subdue our foes who count them mighty.

Sanskit Text: तवं तराता तवमु नो वर्धे भुर्वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ trātā tvamu no vṛdhe bhurvi... ||
Translation: Be our protector, strengthen and increase us. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

Sanskit Text: युवो रजांसि सुयमासो अश्वा रथो यद वां पर्यर्णांसिदियत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvo rajāṃsi suyamāso aśvā ratho yad vāṃ paryarṇāṃsidiyat |
Translation: 1. LIGHTLY your coursers travel through the regions when round the sea of air your car is flying.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यया वां पवयह परुषायन मध्वः पिबन्ता उषसः सचेथे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyayā vāṃ pavayah pruṣāyan madhvaḥ pibantā uṣasaḥ sacethe ||
Translation: Your golden fellies scatter drops of moisture: drinking the sweetness ye

Sanskit Text: <a href="errata.htm#7">
attend
the Mornings.
युवमत्यस्याव नक्षथो यद विपत्मनो नर्यस्य परयज्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvamatyasyāva nakṣatho yad vipatmano naryasya prayajyoḥ |
Translation: 2 Ye as ye travel overtake the Courser who flies apart, the Friend of man, most holy.

Sanskit Text: सवसा यद वां विश्वगूर्ती भराति वाजायेट्टे मधुपाविषे च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svasā yad vāṃ viśvaghūrtī bharāti vājāyeṭṭe madhupāviṣe ca ||
Translation: The prayer is that the Sister may convey you, all praised, meath-drinkers! to support and strengthen.

Sanskit Text: युवं पय उस्रियायामधत्तं पक्वमामायामव पूर्व्यंगोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ paya usriyāyāmadhattaṃ pakvamāmāyāmava pūrvyaṃghoḥ |
Translation: 3 Ye have deposited, matured within her, in the raw cow the first milk of the milch-cow,

Sanskit Text: अन्तर्यद वनिनो वां रतप्सू हवारो न शुचिर्यजते हविष्मान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: antaryad vanino vāṃ ṛtapsū hvāro na śuciryajate haviṣmān ||
Translation: Which the bright offerer, shining like a serpent mid trees, presents to you whose form is perfect.

Sanskit Text: युवं ह घर्मं मधुमन्तमत्रये.अपो न कषोदो.अव्र्णीतमेषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ ha gharmaṃ madhumantamatraye.apo na kṣodo.avṛṇītameṣe |
Translation: 4 Ye made the fierce heat to be full of sweetness for Atri at his wish, like streaming water.

Sanskit Text: तद वां नरावश्विना पश्वैष्टी रथ्येव चक्रा परति यन्ति मध्वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad vāṃ narāvaśvinā paśvaiṣṭī rathyeva cakrā prati yanti madhvaḥ ||
Translation: Fire-offering thence is yours, O Aśvins, Heroes: your car-wheels speed to us like springs of honey.

Sanskit Text: आ वां दानाय वव्र्तीय दस्रा गोरोहेण तौग्र्यो न जिव्रिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ dānāya vavṛtīya dasrā ghoroheṇa taughryo na jivriḥ |
Translation: 5 Like Tugra's ancient son may I, ye Mighty, bring you to give your gifts with milk-oblations.

Sanskit Text: अपः कषोणी सचते माहिना वां जूर्णो वामक्षुरंहसो यजत्रा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apaḥ kṣoṇī sacate māhinā vāṃ jūrṇo vāmakṣuraṃhaso yajatrā ||
Translation: Your greatness compasseth Earth, Heaven, and Waters: decayed for you is sorrow's net, ye Holy.

Sanskit Text: नि यद युवेथे नियुतः सुदानू उप सवधाभिः सर्जथः पुरन्धिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni yad yuvethe niyutaḥ sudānū upa svadhābhiḥ sṛjathaḥ purandhim |
Translation: 6 When, Bounteous Ones, ye drive your yoked team downward, ye send, by your own natures, understanding.

Sanskit Text: परेषद वेषद वातो न सूरिरा महे ददे सुव्रतोन वाजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: preṣad veṣad vāto na sūrirā mahe dade suvratona vājam ||
Translation: Swift as the wind let the prince please and feast you: he, like a pious man, gains strength for increase.

Sanskit Text: वयं चिद धि वां जरितारः सत्या विपन्यामहे वि पणिर्हितावान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ cid dhi vāṃ jaritāraḥ satyā vipanyāmahe vi paṇirhitāvān |
Translation: 7 For verily we truthful singers praise you the niggard trafficker is here excluded.

Sanskit Text: अधा चिद धि षमाश्विनावनिन्द्या पाथो हि षमाव्र्षणावन्तिदेवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā cid dhi ṣmāśvināvanindyā pātho hi ṣmāvṛṣaṇāvantidevam ||
Translation: Now, even now do ye O blameless Aśvins, ye Mighty, guard the man whose God is near him.

Sanskit Text: युवं चिद धि षमाश्विनावनु दयून विरुद्रस्य परस्रवणस्यसातौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ cid dhi ṣmāśvināvanu dyūn virudrasya prasravaṇasyasātau |
Translation: 8 You of a truth day after day, O Aśvins, that he might win the very plenteous torrent,

Sanskit Text: अगस्त्यो नरां नर्षु परशस्तः काराधुनीव चितयत सहस्रैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghastyo narāṃ nṛṣu praśastaḥ kārādhunīva citayat sahasraiḥ ||
Translation: Agastya, famous among mortal heroes, roused with a thousand lauds like sounds of music.

Sanskit Text: पर यद वहेथे महिना रथस्य पर सयन्द्रा याथो मनुषो न होता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yad vahethe mahinā rathasya pra syandrā yātho manuṣo na hotā |
Translation: 9 When with the glory of your car ye travel, when we go speeding like the priest of mortals,

Sanskit Text: धत्तं सूरिभ्य उत व सवश्व्यं नासत्य रयिषाचः सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhattaṃ sūribhya uta va svaśvyaṃ nāsatya rayiṣācaḥ syāma ||
Translation: And give good horses to sacrificers, may we, Nāsatyas! gain our share of riches.

Sanskit Text: तं वां रथं वयमद्या हुवेम सतोमैरश्विना सुवितायनव्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vāṃ rathaṃ vayamadyā huvema stomairaśvinā suvitāyanavyam |
Translation: 10 With songs of praise we call to-day, O Aśvins, that your new chariot, for our own well-being,

Sanskit Text: अरिष्टनेमिं परि दयामियानं वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ariṣṭanemiṃ pari dyāmiyānaṃ vi... ||
Translation: That circles heaven with never-injured fellies. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

Sanskit Text: कदु परेष्टाविषां रयीणामध्वर्यन्ता यदुन्निनीथोपाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadu preṣṭāviṣāṃ rayīṇāmadhvaryantā yadunninīthoapām |
Translation: 1. WHAT, dearest Pair, is this in strength and riches that ye as Priests are bring from the waters?

Sanskit Text: अयं वां यज्ञो अक्र्त परशस्तिं वसुधिती अवितारा जनानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ vāṃ yajño akṛta praśastiṃ vasudhitī avitārā janānām ||
Translation: This sacrifice is your glorification, ye who protect mankind and give them treasures.

Sanskit Text: आ वामश्वासः शुचयः पयस्पा वातरंहसो दिव्यासो अत्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāmaśvāsaḥ śucayaḥ payaspā vātaraṃhaso divyāso atyāḥ |
Translation: 2 May your pure steeds, rain-drinkers, bring you hither, swift as the tempest, your celestial coursers,

Sanskit Text: मनोजुवो वर्षणो वीतप्र्ष्ठा एह सवराजो अश्विनावहन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manojuvo vṛṣaṇo vītapṛṣṭhā eha svarājo aśvināvahantu ||
Translation: Rapid as thought, with fair backs, full of vigour, resplendent in their native light, O Aśvins.

Sanskit Text: आ वां रथो.अवनिर्न परवत्वान सर्प्रवन्धुरः सुविताय गम्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ ratho.avanirna pravatvān sṛpravandhuraḥ suvitāya ghamyāḥ |
Translation: 3 Your car is like a torrent rushing downward: may it come nigh, broad-seated, for our welfare,—

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्ण सथातारा मनसो जवीयानहम्पूर्वो यजतोधिष्ण्या यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṇa sthātārā manaso javīyānahampūrvo yajatodhiṣṇyā yaḥ ||
Translation: Car holy, strong, that ever would be foremost, thought-swift, which ye, for whom we long, have mounted.

Sanskit Text: इहेह जाता समवावशीतामरेपसा तन्वा नामभिः सवैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iheha jātā samavāvaśītāmarepasā tanvā nāmabhiḥ svaiḥ |
Translation: 4 Here sprung to life, they both have sung together, with bodies free from stain, with signs that mark them;

Sanskit Text: जिष्णुर्वामन्यः सुमखस्य सूरिर्दिवो अन्यः सुभगः पुत्र ऊहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jiṣṇurvāmanyaḥ sumakhasya sūrirdivo anyaḥ subhaghaḥ putra ūhe ||
Translation: One of you Prince of Sacrifice, the Victor, the other counts as Heaven's auspicious offspring.

Sanskit Text: पर वां निचेरुः ककुहो वशाननु पिशङगरूपः सदनानि गम्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vāṃ niceruḥ kakuho vaśānanu piśaṅgharūpaḥ sadanāni ghamyāḥ |
Translation: 5 May your car-seat, down-gliding, golden-coloured, according to your wish approach our dwellings.

Sanskit Text: हरी अन्यस्य पीपयन्त वाजैर्मथ्रा रजांस्यश्विना वि घोषैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: harī anyasya pīpayanta vājairmathrā rajāṃsyaśvinā vi ghoṣaiḥ ||
Translation: Men shall feed full the bay steeds of the other, and, Aśvins they with roars shall stir the regions.

Sanskit Text: पर वां शरद्वान वर्षभो न निष्षाट पूर्वीरिषश्चरति मध्व इष्णन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vāṃ śaradvān vṛṣabho na niṣṣāṭ pūrvīriṣaścarati madhva iṣṇan |
Translation: 6 Forth comes your strong Bull like a cloud of autumn, sending abundant food of liquid sweetness.

Sanskit Text: एवैरन्यस्य पीपयन्त वाजैर्वेषन्तीरूर्ध्वा नद्यो न आगुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evairanyasya pīpayanta vājairveṣantīrūrdhvā nadyo na āghuḥ ||
Translation: Let them feed with the other's ways and vigour: the upper streams have come and do us service.

Sanskit Text: असर्जि वां सथविरा वेधसा गीर्बाळ्हे अश्विना तरेधा कषरन्ती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asarji vāṃ sthavirā vedhasā ghīrbāḷhe aśvinā tredhā kṣarantī |
Translation: 7 Your constant song hath been sent forth, Disposers! that flows threefold in mighty strength, O Aśvins.

Sanskit Text: उपस्तुताववतं नाधमानं यामन्नयामञ्छ्र्णुतं हवं मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upastutāvavataṃ nādhamānaṃ yāmannayāmañchṛṇutaṃ havaṃ me ||
Translation: Thus lauded, give the suppliant protection moving or resting hear mine invocation.

Sanskit Text: उत सया वां रुशतो वप्ससो गीस्त्रिबर्हिषि सदसि पिन्वतेनॄन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta syā vāṃ ruśato vapsaso ghīstribarhiṣi sadasi pinvatenṝn |
Translation: 8 This song of bright contents for you is swelling in the men's hall where three-fold grass is ready.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा वां मेघो वर्षणा पीपाय गोर्न सेके मनुषोदशस्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā vāṃ megho vṛṣaṇā pīpāya ghorna seke manuṣodaśasyan ||
Translation: Your strong rain-cloud, ye Mighty Ones, hath swollen, honouring men as ’twere with milk's outpouring.

Sanskit Text: युवां पूषेवाश्विना पुरन्धिरग्निमुषां न जरते हविष्मान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvāṃ pūṣevāśvinā purandhiraghnimuṣāṃ na jarate haviṣmān |
Translation: 9 The prudent worshipper, like Pūṣan, Aśvins! praises you as he praises Dawn and Agni,

Sanskit Text: हुवे यद वां वरिवस्या गर्णानो वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: huve yad vāṃ varivasyā ghṛṇāno vi... ||
Translation: When, singing with devotion, he invokes you. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

Sanskit Text: अभूदिदं वयुनमो षु भूषता रथो वर्षण्वान मदता मनीषिणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhūdidaṃ vayunamo ṣu bhūṣatā ratho vṛṣaṇvān madatā manīṣiṇaḥ |
Translation: 1. THIS was the task. Appear promptly, ye prudent Ones. Here is the chariot drawn by strong steeds: be ye glad.

Sanskit Text: धियंजिन्वा धिष्ण्या विश्पलावसू दिवो नपात सुक्र्ते शुचिव्रता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiyaṃjinvā dhiṣṇyā viśpalāvasū divo napāta sukṛte śucivratā ||
Translation: Heart-stirring, longed for, succourers of Viśpalā, here are Heaven's Sons whose sway blesses the pious man.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रतमा हि धिष्ण्या मरुत्तमा दस्रा दंसिष्ठा रथ्या रथीतमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indratamā hi dhiṣṇyā maruttamā dasrā daṃsiṣṭhā rathyā rathītamā |
Translation: 2 Longed for, most Indra-like, mighty, most Marut-like, most wonderful in deed, car-borne, best charioteers,

Sanskit Text: पूर्णं रथं वहेथे मध्व आचितं तेन दाश्वांसमुप याथो अश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrṇaṃ rathaṃ vahethe madhva ācitaṃ tena dāśvāṃsamupa yātho aśvinā ||
Translation: Bring your full chariot hither heaped with liquid sweet: thereon, ye Aśvins, come to him who offers gifts.

Sanskit Text: किमत्र दस्रा कर्णुथः किमासाथे जनो यः कश्चिदहविर्महीयते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kimatra dasrā kṛṇuthaḥ kimāsāthe jano yaḥ kaścidahavirmahīyate |
Translation: 3 What make ye there, ye Mighty? Wherefore linger ye with folk who, offering not, are held in high esteem?

Sanskit Text: अति करमिष्टं जुरतं पणेरसुं जयोतिर्विप्राय कर्णुतं वचस्यवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ati kramiṣṭaṃ jurataṃ paṇerasuṃ jyotirviprāya kṛṇutaṃ vacasyave ||
Translation: Pass over them; make ye the niggard's life decay: give light unto the singer eloquent in praise.

Sanskit Text: जम्भयतमभितो रायतः शुनो हतं मर्धो विदथुस्तान्यश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jambhayatamabhito rāyataḥ śuno hataṃ mṛdho vidathustānyaśvinā |
Translation: 4 Crunch up on. every side the dogs who bark at us: slay ye our foes, O Aśvins this ye understand.

Sanskit Text: वाचं-वाचं जरितू रत्निनीं कर्तमुभा शंसं नासत्यावतं मम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vācaṃ-vācaṃ jaritū ratninīṃ kṛtamubhā śaṃsaṃ nāsatyāvataṃ mama ||
Translation: Make wealthy every word of him who praises you: accept with favour, both Nāsatyas, this my laud.

Sanskit Text: युवमेतं चक्रथुः सिन्धुषु पलवमात्मन्वन्तं पक्षिणन्तौग्र्याय कम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvametaṃ cakrathuḥ sindhuṣu plavamātmanvantaṃ pakṣiṇantaughryāya kam |
Translation: 5 Ye made for Tugra's son amid the water-floods that animated ship with wings to fly withal,

Sanskit Text: येन देवत्रा मनसा निरूहथुः सुपप्तनीपेतथुः कषोदसो महः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena devatrā manasā nirūhathuḥ supaptanīpetathuḥ kṣodaso mahaḥ ||
Translation: Whereon with God-devoted mind ye brought him forth, and fled with easy flight from out the mighty surge.

Sanskit Text: अवविद्धं तौग्र्यमप्स्वन्तरनारम्भणे तमसि परविद्धम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avaviddhaṃ taughryamapsvantaranārambhaṇe tamasi praviddham |
Translation: 6 Four ships most welcome in the midst of ocean, urged by the Aśvins, save the son of Tugra,

Sanskit Text: चतस्रो नावो जठलस्य जुष्टा उदश्विभ्यामिषिताः पारयन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: catasro nāvo jaṭhalasya juṣṭā udaśvibhyāmiṣitāḥ pārayanti ||
Translation: Him who was cast down headlong in the waters, plunged in the thick inevitable darkness.

Sanskit Text: कः सविद वर्क्षो निष्ठितो मध्ये अर्णसो यं तौग्र्यो नाधितः पर्यषस्वजत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaḥ svid vṛkṣo niṣṭhito madhye arṇaso yaṃ taughryo nādhitaḥ paryaṣasvajat |
Translation: 7 What tree was that which stood fixed in surrounding sea to which the son of Tugra supplicating clung?

Sanskit Text: पर्णा मर्गस्य पतरोरिवारभ उदश्विना ऊहथुः शरोमताय कम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parṇā mṛghasya patarorivārabha udaśvinā ūhathuḥ śromatāya kam ||
Translation: Like twigs, of which some winged creature may take hold, ye, Aśvins, bore him off safely to your renown.

Sanskit Text: तद वां नरा नासत्यावनु षयाद यद वां मानास उचथमवोचन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad vāṃ narā nāsatyāvanu ṣyād yad vāṃ mānāsa ucathamavocan |
Translation: 8 Welcome to you be this the hymn of praises uttered by Mānas, O Nāsatyas, Heroes,

Sanskit Text: अस्मादद्य सदसः सोम्यादा] वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmādadya sadasaḥ somyādā] vi... ||
Translation: From this our gathering where we offer Soma. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

Sanskit Text: तं युञ्जाथां मनसो यो जवीयान तरिवन्धुरो वर्षण यस्त्रिचक्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ yuñjāthāṃ manaso yo javīyān trivandhuro vṛṣaṇa yastricakraḥ |
Translation: 1. MAKE ready that which passes thought in swiftness, that hath three wheels and triple seat, ye Mighty,

Sanskit Text: येनोपयाथः सुक्र्तो दुरोणं तरिधातुन पतथोविर्न पर्णैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenopayāthaḥ sukṛto duroṇaṃ tridhātuna patathovirna parṇaiḥ ||
Translation: Whereon ye seek the dwelling of the pious, whereon, threefold, ye fly like birds with pinions.

Sanskit Text: सुव्र्द रथो वर्तते यन्नभि कषां यत तिष्ठथः करतुमन्तानु पर्क्षे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvṛd ratho vartate yannabhi kṣāṃ yat tiṣṭhathaḥ kratumantānu pṛkṣe |
Translation: 2 Light rolls your easy chariot faring earthward, what time, for food, ye, full of wisdom, mount it.

Sanskit Text: वपुर्वपुष्या सचतामियं गीर्दिवो दुहित्रोषसा सचेथे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vapurvapuṣyā sacatāmiyaṃ ghīrdivo duhitroṣasā sacethe ||
Translation: May this song, wondrous fair, attend your glory: ye, as ye travel, wait on Dawn Heaven's Daughter.

Sanskit Text: आ तिष्ठतं सुव्र्तं यो रथो वामनु वरतानि वर्तते हविष्मान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tiṣṭhataṃ suvṛtaṃ yo ratho vāmanu vratāni vartate haviṣmān |
Translation: 3 Ascend your lightly rolling car, approaching the worshipper who turns him to his duties,—

Sanskit Text: येन नरा नासत्येषयध्यै वर्तिर्याथस्तनयायत्मने च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena narā nāsatyeṣayadhyai vartiryāthastanayāyatmane ca ||
Translation: Whereon ye come unto the house to quicken man and his offspring, O Nāsatyas, Heroes.

Sanskit Text: मा वां वर्को मा वर्कीरा दधर्षीन मा परि वर्क्तमुतमाति धक्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā vāṃ vṛko mā vṛkīrā dadharṣīn mā pari varktamutamāti dhaktam |
Translation: 4 Let not the wolf, let not the she-wolf harm you. Forsake me not, nor pass me by or others.

Sanskit Text: अयं वां भागो निहित इयं गीर्दस्राविमे वां निधयो मधूनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ vāṃ bhāgho nihita iyaṃ ghīrdasrāvime vāṃ nidhayo madhūnām ||
Translation: Here stands your share, here is your hymn, ye Mighty: yours are these vessels, full of pleasant juices.

Sanskit Text: युवां गोतमः पुरुमीळ्हो अत्रिर्दस्रा हवते.अवसे हविष्मान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvāṃ ghotamaḥ purumīḷho atrirdasrā havate.avase haviṣmān |
Translation: 5 Gotama, Purumīlha, Atri bringing oblations all invoke you for protection.

Sanskit Text: दिशं न दिष्टां रजूयेव यन्ता मे हवं नासत्योप यातम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: diśaṃ na diṣṭāṃ ṛjūyeva yantā me havaṃ nāsatyopa yātam ||
Translation: Like one who goes straight to the point directed, ye Nāsatyas, to mine invocation.

Sanskit Text: अतारिष्म तमसस पारमस्य परति वां सतोमो अश्विनावधायि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atāriṣma tamasas pāramasya prati vāṃ stomo aśvināvadhāyi |
Translation: 6 We have passed o’er the limit of this darkness: our praise hath been bestowed on you, O Aśvins.

Sanskit Text: एह यातं पथिभिर्देवयानैर्वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eha yātaṃ pathibhirdevayānairvi... ||
Translation: Come hitherward by paths which Gods have travelled. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

Sanskit Text: कतरा पूर्वा कतरापरायोः कथा जाते कवयः को वि वेद |
Sanskrit Transliteration: katarā pūrvā katarāparāyoḥ kathā jāte kavayaḥ ko vi veda |
Translation: 1. WHETHER of these is elder, whether later? How were they born? Who knoweth it, ye sages?

Sanskit Text: विश्वं तमना बिभ्र्तो यद ध नाम वि वर्तेते अहनी चक्रियेव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvaṃ tmanā bibhṛto yad dha nāma vi vartete ahanī cakriyeva ||
Translation: These of themselves support all things existing: as on a car the Day and Night roll onward.

Sanskit Text: भूरिं दवे अचरन्ती चरन्तं पद्वन्तं गर्भमपदी दधाते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūriṃ dve acarantī carantaṃ padvantaṃ gharbhamapadī dadhāte |
Translation: 2 The Twain uphold, though motionless and footless, a widespread offspring having feet and moving.

Sanskit Text: नित्यं न सूनुं पित्रोरुपस्थे दयावा रक्षतं पर्थिवी नो अभ्वात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nityaṃ na sūnuṃ pitrorupasthe dyāvā rakṣataṃ pṛthivī no abhvāt ||
Translation: Like your own son upon his parents’ bosom, protect us, Heaven and earth, from fearful danger.

Sanskit Text: अनेहो दात्रमदितेरनर्वं हुवे सवर्वदवधं नमस्वत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aneho dātramaditeranarvaṃ huve svarvadavadhaṃ namasvat |
Translation: 3 I call for Aditi's unrivalled bounty, perfect, celestial, deathless, meet for worship.

Sanskit Text: तद रोदसी जनयतं जरित्रे दयावा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad rodasī janayataṃ jaritre dyāvā ... ||
Translation: Produce this, ye Twain Worlds, for him who lauds you. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

Sanskit Text: अतप्यमाने अवसावन्ती अनु षयाम रोदसी देवपुत्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atapyamāne avasāvantī anu ṣyāma rodasī devaputre |
Translation: 4 May we be close to both the Worlds who suffer no pain, Parents of Gods, who aid with favour,

Sanskit Text: उभे देवानामुभयेभिरह्नां दयावा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhe devānāmubhayebhirahnāṃ dyāvā ... ||
Translation: Both mid the Gods, with Day and Night alternate. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

Sanskit Text: संगछमाने युवती समन्ते सवसारा जामी पित्रोरुपस्थे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃghachamāne yuvatī samante svasārā jāmī pitrorupasthe |
Translation: 5 Faring together, young, with meeting limits, Twin Sisters lying in their Parents’ bosom,

Sanskit Text: अभिजिघ्रन्ती भुवनस्य नाभिं दयावा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhijighrantī bhuvanasya nābhiṃ dyāvā ... ||
Translation: Kissing the centre of the world together. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

Sanskit Text: उर्वी सद्मनी बर्हती रतेन हुवे देवानामवसा जनित्री |
Sanskrit Transliteration: urvī sadmanī bṛhatī ṛtena huve devānāmavasā janitrī |
Translation: 6 Duly I call the two wide seats, the mighty, the general Parents, with the God's protection.

Sanskit Text: दधाते ये अम्र्तं सुप्रतीके दयावा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhāte ye amṛtaṃ supratīke dyāvā ... ||
Translation: Who, beautiful to look on, make the nectar. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

Sanskit Text: उर्वी पर्थ्वी बहुले दूरेन्ते उप बरुवे नमसा यज्ञे अस्मिन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: urvī pṛthvī bahule dūreante upa bruve namasā yajñe asmin |
Translation: 7 Wide, vast, and manifold, whose bounds are distant,—these, reverent, I address at this our worship,

Sanskit Text: दधाते ये सुभगे सुप्रतूर्ती दयावा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhāte ye subhaghe supratūrtī dyāvā ... ||
Translation: The blessed Pair, victorious, all-sustaining. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

Sanskit Text: देवान वा यच्चक्र्मा कच्चिदागः सखायं वा सदमिज्जास्पतिं वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devān vā yaccakṛmā kaccidāghaḥ sakhāyaṃ vā sadamijjāspatiṃ vā |
Translation: 8 What sin we have at any time committed against the Gods, our friend, our house's chieftain,

Sanskit Text: इयं धीर्भूया अवयानमेषां दयावा .. . ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyaṃ dhīrbhūyā avayānameṣāṃ dyāvā .. . ||
Translation: Thereof may this our hymn be expiation. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

Sanskit Text: उभा शंसा नर्या मामविष्टामुभे मामूती अवसा सचेताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhā śaṃsā naryā māmaviṣṭāmubhe māmūtī avasā sacetām |
Translation: 9 May both these Friends of man, who bless, preserve me, may they attend me with their help and favour.

Sanskit Text: भूरि चिदर्यः सुदास्तरायेषा मदन्त इषयेम देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūri cidaryaḥ sudāstarāyeṣā madanta iṣayema devāḥ ||
Translation: Enrich the man more liberal than the godless. May we, ye Gods, be strong with food rejoicing.

Sanskit Text: रतं दिवे तदवोचं पर्थिव्या अभिश्रावाय परथमं सुमेधाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtaṃ dive tadavocaṃ pṛthivyā abhiśrāvāya prathamaṃ sumedhāḥ |
Translation: 10 Endowed with understanding, I have uttered this truth, for all to hear, to Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: पातामवद्याद दुरितादभीके पिता माता च रक्षतामवोभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pātāmavadyād duritādabhīke pitā mātā ca rakṣatāmavobhiḥ ||
Translation: Be near us, keep us from reproach and trouble. Father and Mother, with your help preserve us.

Sanskit Text: इदं दयावाप्र्थिवी सत्यमस्तु पितर्मातर्यदिहोपब्रुवे वाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī satyamastu pitarmātaryadihopabruve vām |
Translation: 11 Be this my prayer fulfilled, O Earth and Heaven, wherewith, Father and Mother, I address you.

Sanskit Text: भूतं देवानामवमे अवोभिर्विद्या... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūtaṃ devānāmavame avobhirvidyā... ||
Translation: Nearest of Gods be ye with your protection. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

Sanskit Text: समिद्धो अद्य राजसि देवो देवैः सहस्रजित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samiddho adya rājasi devo devaiḥ sahasrajit |
Translation: 1. WINNER of thousands, kindled, thou shinest a God with Gods to-day.

Sanskit Text: दूतो हव्या कविर्वह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūto havyā kavirvaha ||
Translation: Bear out oblations, envoy, Sage.

Sanskit Text: तनुनपाद रतं यते मध्वा यज्ञः समज्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tanunapād ṛtaṃ yate madhvā yajñaḥ samajyate |
Translation: 2 Child of Thyself the sacrifice is for the righteous blent with meath,

Sanskit Text: दधत सहस्रिणीरिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhat sahasriṇīriṣaḥ ||
Translation: Presenting viands thousandfold.

Sanskit Text: आजुह्वानो न ईड्यो देवाना वक्षि यज्ञियान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ājuhvāno na īḍyo devānā vakṣi yajñiyān |
Translation: 3 Invoked and worthy of our praise bring Gods whose due is sacrifice:

Sanskit Text: अग्ने सहस्रसा असि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne sahasrasā asi ||
Translation: Thou, Agni, givest countless gifts.

Sanskit Text: पराचीनं बर्हिरोजसा सहस्रवीरमस्त्र्णन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prācīnaṃ barhirojasā sahasravīramastṛṇan |
Translation: 4 To seat a thousand Heroes they eastward have strewn the grass with might,

Sanskit Text: यत्रादित्या विराजथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatrādityā virājatha ||
Translation: Whereon, Ādityas, ye shine forth.

Sanskit Text: विराट सम्राड विभ्वीः परभ्वीर्बह्वीश्च भूयसीश्चयाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: virāṭ samrāḍ vibhvīḥ prabhvīrbahvīśca bhūyasīścayāḥ |
Translation: 5 The sovran all-imperial Doors, wide, good, many and manifold,

Sanskit Text: दुरो घर्तान्यक्षरन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: duro ghṛtānyakṣaran ||
Translation: Have poured their streams of holy oil.

Sanskit Text: सुरुक्मे हि सुपेशसाधि शरिया विराजतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: surukme hi supeśasādhi śriyā virājataḥ |
Translation: 6 With gay adornment, fair to see, in glorious beauty shine they forth:

Sanskit Text: उषासावेहसीदताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣāsāvehasīdatām ||
Translation: Let Night and Morning rest them here.

Sanskit Text: परथमा हि सुवाचसा होतारा दैव्या कवी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prathamā hi suvācasā hotārā daivyā kavī |
Translation: 7 Let these two Sages first of all, heralds divine and eloquent,

Sanskit Text: यज्ञं नो यक्षतामिमम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñaṃ no yakṣatāmimam ||
Translation: Perform for us this sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: भारतीळे सरस्वति या वः सर्वा उपब्रुवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhāratīḷe sarasvati yā vaḥ sarvā upabruve |
Translation: 8 You I address, Sarasvatī, and Bhāratī, and Iḷā, all:

Sanskit Text: ता नश्चोदयत शरिये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā naścodayata śriye ||
Translation: Urge ye us on to glorious fame.

Sanskit Text: तवष्टा रूपाणि हि परभुः पशुन विश्वान समानजे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi hi prabhuḥ paśun viśvān samānaje |
Translation: 9 Tvaṣṭar the Lord hath made all forms and all the cattle of the field

Sanskit Text: तेषां नः सफातिमा यज ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: teṣāṃ naḥ sphātimā yaja ||
Translation: Cause them to multiply for us.

Sanskit Text: उप तमन्या वनस्पते पाथो देवेभ्यः सर्ज |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa tmanyā vanaspate pātho devebhyaḥ sṛja |
Translation: 10 Send to the Gods, Vanaspati, thyself, the sacrificial draught:

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्हव्यानि सिष्वदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirhavyāni siṣvadat ||
Translation: Let Agni make the oblations sweet.

Sanskit Text: पुरोगा अग्निर्देवानां गायत्रेण समज्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: puroghā aghnirdevānāṃ ghāyatreṇa samajyate |
Translation: 11 Agni, preceder of the Gods, is honoured with the sacred song:

Sanskit Text: सवाहाक्र्तीषु रोचते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāhākṛtīṣu rocate ||
Translation: He glows at offerings blest with Hail!

Sanskit Text: अग्ने नय सुपथा राये अस्मान विश्वानि देव वयुनानि विद्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne naya supathā rāye asmān viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān |
Translation: 1. BY goodly paths lead us to riches, Agni, God who knowest every sacred duty.

Sanskit Text: युयोध्यस्मज्जुहुराणमेनो भूयिष्ठां ते नमौक्तिंविधेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuyodhyasmajjuhurāṇameno bhūyiṣṭhāṃ te namauktiṃvidhema ||
Translation: Remove the sin that makes us stray and wander. most ample adoration will we bring thee.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने तवं पारया नव्यो अस्मान सवस्तिभिरति दुर्गाणि विश्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne tvaṃ pārayā navyo asmān svastibhirati durghāṇi viśvā |
Translation: 2 Lead us anew to happiness, O Agni; lead us beyond all danger and affliction.

Sanskit Text: पुश्च पर्थ्वी बहुला न उर्वि भवा तोकाय तनयाय शं योः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: puśca pṛthvī bahulā na urvi bhavā tokāya tanayāya śaṃ yoḥ ||
Translation: Be unto us a wide broad ample castle bless, prosper on their way our sons and offspring.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने तवमस्मद युयोध्यमीवा अनग्नित्रा अभ्यमन्त कर्ष्टीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne tvamasmad yuyodhyamīvā anaghnitrā abhyamanta kṛṣṭīḥ |
Translation: 3 Far from us, Agni, put thou all diseases let them strike lauds that have no saving Agni.

Sanskit Text: पुनरस्मभ्यं सुविताय देव कषां विश्वेभिरम्र्तेभिर्यजत्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punarasmabhyaṃ suvitāya deva kṣāṃ viśvebhiramṛtebhiryajatra ||
Translation: God, make our home again to be a blessing, with all the Immortal Deities, O Holy.

Sanskit Text: पाहि नो अग्ने पायुभिरजस्रैरुत परिये सदन आ शुशुक्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāhi no aghne pāyubhirajasrairuta priye sadana ā śuśukvān |
Translation: 4 Preserve us, Agni, with perpetual succour, refulgent in the dwelling which thou lovest.

Sanskit Text: मा ते भयं जरितारं यविष्ठ नूनं विदन मापरं सहस्वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā te bhayaṃ jaritāraṃ yaviṣṭha nūnaṃ vidan māparaṃ sahasvaḥ ||
Translation: O Conqueror, most youthful, let no danger touch him who praises thee to-day or after.

Sanskit Text: मा नो अग्ने.अव सर्जो अघायाविष्यवे रिपवे दुछुनायै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no aghne.ava sṛjo aghāyāviṣyave ripave duchunāyai |
Translation: 5 Give not us up a prey to sin, O Agni, the greedy enemy that brings us trouble;

Sanskit Text: मादत्वते दशते मादते नो मा रीषते सहसावन परा दाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mādatvate daśate mādate no mā rīṣate sahasāvan parā dāḥ ||
Translation: Not to the fanged that bites, not to the toothless: give not us up, thou Conqueror, to the spoiler.

Sanskit Text: वि घ तवावान रतजात यंसद गर्णानो अग्ने तन्वे वरूथम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi gha tvāvān ṛtajāta yaṃsad ghṛṇāno aghne tanve varūtham |
Translation: 6 Such as thou art, born after Law, O Agni when lauded give protection to our bodies,

Sanskit Text: विश्वाद रिरिक्षोरुत वा निनित्सोरभिह्रुतामसि हि देव विष्पट ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvād ririkṣoruta vā ninitsorabhihrutāmasi hi deva viṣpaṭ ||
Translation: From whosoever would reproach or injure: for thou, God, rescuest from all oppression.

Sanskit Text: तवं तानग्न उभयानिव विद्वान वेषि परपित्वे मनुषो यजत्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tānaghna ubhayāniv vidvān veṣi prapitve manuṣo yajatra |
Translation: 7 Thou, well discerning both these classes, comest to men at early morn, O holy Agni.

Sanskit Text: अभिपित्वे मनवे शास्यो भूर्मर्म्र्जेन्य उशिग्भिर्नाक्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhipitve manave śāsyo bhūrmarmṛjenya uśighbhirnākraḥ ||
Translation: Be thou obedient unto man at evening, to be adorned, as keen, by eager suitors.

Sanskit Text: अवोचाम निवचनान्यस्मिन मानस्य सूनुः सहसाने अग्नौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avocāma nivacanānyasmin mānasya sūnuḥ sahasāne aghnau |
Translation: 8 To him have we addressed our pious speeches, I, Māna's son, to him victorious Agni.

Sanskit Text: वयं सहस्रं रषिभिः सनेम वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ sahasraṃ ṛṣibhiḥ sanema vi... ||
Translation: May we gain countless riches with the sages. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

Sanskit Text: अनर्वाणं वर्षभं मन्द्रजिह्वं बर्हस्पतिं वर्धया नव्यमर्कैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anarvāṇaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ mandrajihvaṃ bṛhaspatiṃ vardhayā navyamarkaiḥ |
Translation: 1. GLORIFY thou Bṛhaspati, the scatheless, who must be praised with hymns, sweet-tongued and mighty,

Sanskit Text: गाथान्यः सुरुचो यस्य देवा आश्र्ण्वन्ति नवमानस्य मर्ताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāthānyaḥ suruco yasya devā āśṛṇvanti navamānasya martāḥ ||
Translation: To whom as leader of the song, resplendent, worthy of lauds, both Gods and mortals listen.

Sanskit Text: तं रत्विया उप वाचः सचन्ते सर्गो न यो देवयतामसर्जि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ ṛtviyā upa vācaḥ sacante sargho na yo devayatāmasarji |
Translation: 2 On him wait songs according to the season even as a stream of pious men set moving.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिः स हयञ्जो वरांसि विभ्वाभवत सं रते मातरिश्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiḥ sa hyañjo varāṃsi vibhvābhavat saṃ ṛte mātariśvā ||
Translation: Bṛhaspati—for he laid out the expanses—was, at the sacrifice, vast Mātariśvan.

Sanskit Text: उपस्तुतिं नमस उद्यतिं च शलोकं यंसत सवितेव पर बाहू |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upastutiṃ namasa udyatiṃ ca ślokaṃ yaṃsat saviteva pra bāhū |
Translation: 3 The praise, the verse that offers adoration, may he bring forth, as the Sun sends his arms out,

Sanskit Text: अस्य करत्वाहन्यो यो अस्ति मर्गो न भीमो अरक्षसस्तुविष्मान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya kratvāhanyo yo asti mṛgho na bhīmo arakṣasastuviṣmān ||
Translation: He who gives daily light through this God's wisdom, strong as a dread wild beast, and inoffensive.

Sanskit Text: अस्य शलोको दिवीयते पर्थिव्यामत्यो न यंसद यक्षभ्र्द विचेताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya śloko divīyate pṛthivyāmatyo na yaṃsad yakṣabhṛd vicetāḥ |
Translation: 4 His song of praise pervades the earth and heaven: let the wise worshipper draw it, like a courser.

Sanskit Text: मर्गाणां न हेतयो यन्ति चेमा बर्हस्पतेरहिमायानभि दयून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mṛghāṇāṃ na hetayo yanti cemā bṛhaspaterahimāyānabhi dyūn ||
Translation: These of Bṛhaspati, like hunters' arrows, go to the skies that change their hue like serpents.

Sanskit Text: ये तवा देवोस्रिकं मन्यमानाः पापा भद्रमुपजीवन्ति पज्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye tvā devosrikaṃ manyamānāḥ pāpā bhadramupajīvanti pajrāḥ |
Translation: 5 Those, God, who count thee as a worthless bullock, and, wealthy sinners, live on thee the Bounteous,—

Sanskit Text: न दूढ्ये अनु ददासि वामं बर्हस्पते चयस इत पियारुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na dūḍhye anu dadāsi vāmaṃ bṛhaspate cayasa it piyārum ||
Translation: On fools like these no blessing thou bestowest: Bṛhaspati, thou punishest the spiteful.

Sanskit Text: सुप्रैतुः सूयवसो न पन्था दुर्नियन्तुः परिप्रीतो न मित्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: supraituḥ sūyavaso na panthā durniyantuḥ pariprīto na mitraḥ |
Translation: 6 Like a fair path is he, where grass is pleasant, though hard to win, a Friend beloved most early.

Sanskit Text: अनर्वाणो अभि ये चक्षते नो.अपीव्र्ता अपोर्णुवन्तो अस्थुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anarvāṇo abhi ye cakṣate no.apīvṛtā aporṇuvanto asthuḥ ||
Translation: Those who unharmed by enemies behold us, while they would make them bare, stood closely compassed.

Sanskit Text: सं यं सतुभो.अवनयो न यन्ति समुद्रं न सरवतो रोधचक्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yaṃ stubho.avanayo na yanti samudraṃ na sravato rodhacakrāḥ |
Translation: 7 He to whom songs of praise go forth like torrents, as rivers eddying under banks flow sea-ward—

Sanskit Text: स विद्वानुभयं चष्टे अन्तर्ब्र्हस्पतिस्तर आपश्च गर्ध्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vidvānubhayaṃ caṣṭe antarbṛhaspatistara āpaśca ghṛdhraḥ ||
Translation: Bṛhaspati the wise, the eager, closely looks upon both, the waters and the vessel.

Sanskit Text: एवा महस्तुविजातस्तुविष्मान बर्हस्पतिर्व्र्षभो धायि देवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā mahastuvijātastuviṣmān bṛhaspatirvṛṣabho dhāyi devaḥ |
Translation: 8 So hath Bṛhaspati, great, strong and mighty, the God exceeding powerful, been brought hither.

Sanskit Text: स न सतुतो वीरवद धातु गोमद वि... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa na stuto vīravad dhātu ghomad vi... ||
Translation: May he thus lauded give us kine and horses. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

Sanskit Text: कङकतो न कङकतो.अथो सतीनकङकतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaṅkato na kaṅkato.atho satīnakaṅkataḥ |
Translation: 1. VENOMOUS, slightly venomous, or venomous aquatic worm,—

Sanskit Text: दवाविति पलुषी इति नयद्र्ष्ट अलिप्सत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvāviti pluṣī iti nyadṛṣṭa alipsata ||
Translation: Both creatures, stinging, unobserved, with poison have infected me.

Sanskit Text: अद्र्ष्टान हन्त्यायत्यथो हन्ति परायती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adṛṣṭān hantyāyatyatho hanti parāyatī |
Translation: 2 Coming, it kills the unobserved; it kills them as it goes away,

Sanskit Text: अथो अवघ्नती हन्त्यथो पिनष्टि पिंषती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atho avaghnatī hantyatho pinaṣṭi piṃṣatī ||
Translation: It kills them as it drives them off, and bruising bruises them to death.

Sanskit Text: शरासः कुशरासो दर्भासः सैर्या उत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śarāsaḥ kuśarāso darbhāsaḥ sairyā uta |
Translation: 3 Sara grass, Darbha, Kuśara, and Sairya, Muñja, Vīraṇa,

Sanskit Text: मौञ्जा अद्र्ष्टा वैरिणाः सर्वे साकं नयलिप्सत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mauñjā adṛṣṭā vairiṇāḥ sarve sākaṃ nyalipsata ||
Translation: Where all these creatures dwell unseen, with poison have infected me.

Sanskit Text: नि गावो गोष्ठे असदन नि मर्गासो अविक्षत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni ghāvo ghoṣṭhe asadan ni mṛghāso avikṣata |
Translation: 4 The cows had settled in their stalls, the beasts of prey had sought their lairs,

Sanskit Text: नि केतवो जनानां नयद्र्ष्टा अलिप्सत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni ketavo janānāṃ nyadṛṣṭā alipsata ||
Translation: Extinguished were the lights of men, when things unseen infected me.

Sanskit Text: एत उ तये परत्यद्र्श्रन परदोषं तस्करा इव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eta u tye pratyadṛśran pradoṣaṃ taskarā iva |
Translation: 5 Or these, these reptiles, are observed, like lurking thieves at evening time.

Sanskit Text: अद्र्ष्टा विश्वद्र्ष्टाः परतिबुद्धा अभूतन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adṛṣṭā viśvadṛṣṭāḥ pratibuddhā abhūtana ||
Translation: Seers of all, themselves unseen: be therefore very vigilant.

Sanskit Text: दयौर्वः पिता पर्थिवी माता सोमो भरातादितिः सवसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyaurvaḥ pitā pṛthivī mātā somo bhrātāditiḥ svasā |
Translation: 6 Heaven is your Sire, your Mother Earth, Soma your Brother, Aditi

Sanskit Text: अद्र्ष्टा विश्वद्र्ष्टास्तिष्ठतेलयता सु कम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adṛṣṭā viśvadṛṣṭāstiṣṭhatelayatā su kam ||
Translation: Your Sister: seeing all, unseen, keep still and dwell ye happily.

Sanskit Text: ये अंस्या ये अङगयाः सूचीका ये परकङकताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye aṃsyā ye aṅghyāḥ sūcīkā ye prakaṅkatāḥ |
Translation: 7 Biters of shoulder or of limb, with needle-stings, most venomous,

Sanskit Text: अद्र्ष्टाः किं चनेह वः सर्वे साकं नि जस्यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adṛṣṭāḥ kiṃ caneha vaḥ sarve sākaṃ ni jasyata ||
Translation: Unseen, whatever ye may be, vanish together and be gone.

Sanskit Text: उत पुरस्तात सूर्य एति विश्वद्र्ष्टो अद्र्ष्टहा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut purastāt sūrya eti viśvadṛṣṭo adṛṣṭahā |
Translation: 8 Slayer of things unseen, the Sun, beheld of all, mounts, eastward, up,

Sanskit Text: अद्र्ष्टान सर्वाञ जम्भयन सर्वाश्च यातुधान्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adṛṣṭān sarvāñ jambhayan sarvāśca yātudhānyaḥ ||
Translation: Consuming all that are not seen, and evil spirits of the night.

Sanskit Text: उदपप्तदसौ सूर्यः पुरु विश्वानि जूर्वन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udapaptadasau sūryaḥ puru viśvāni jūrvan |
Translation: 9 There hath the Sun-God mounted up, who scorches much and everything.

Sanskit Text: आदित्यः पर्वतेभ्यो विश्वद्र्ष्टो अद्र्ष्टहा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityaḥ parvatebhyo viśvadṛṣṭo adṛṣṭahā ||
Translation: Even the Āditya from the hills, all-seen, destroying things unseen.

Sanskit Text: सूर्ये विषमा सजामि दर्तिं सुरावतो गर्हे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūrye viṣamā sajāmi dṛtiṃ surāvato ghṛhe |
Translation: 10 I hang the poison in the Sun, a wine-skin in a vintner's house,

Sanskit Text: सो चिन नु नमराति नो वयं मरामारे अस्य योजनं हरिष्ठा मधु तवामधुला चकार ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: so cin nu namarāti no vayaṃ marāmāre asya yojanaṃ hariṣṭhā madhu tvāmadhulā cakāra ||
Translation: He will not die, nor shall we die: his path is far: he whom Bay Horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath.

Sanskit Text: इयत्तिका शकुन्तिका सका जघास ते विषम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyattikā śakuntikā sakā jaghāsa te viṣam |
Translation: 11 This little bird, so very small, hath swallowed all thy poison up.

Sanskrit Transliteration: so cin nu ... ||
Translation: She will not die, nor shall we die: his path is far: he whom Bay Horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath.

Sanskit Text: तरिः सप्त विष्पुलिङगका विषस्य पुष्यमक्षन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: triḥ sapta viṣpuliṅghakā viṣasya puṣyamakṣan |
Translation: 12 The three-times-seven bright sparks of fire have swallowed up the poison's strength.

Sanskit Text: ताश्चिन्नु न मरन्ति नो वयं म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāścinnu na maranti no vayaṃ ma... ||
Translation: They will not die, nor shall we die: his path is far: he whom Bay Horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath.

Sanskit Text: नवानां नवतीनां विषस्य रोपुषीणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: navānāṃ navatīnāṃ viṣasya ropuṣīṇām |
Translation: 13 Of ninety rivers and of nine with power to stay the venom's course,—

Sanskit Text: सर्वासामग्रभं नामारे अस्य यो... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarvāsāmaghrabhaṃ nāmāre asya yo... ||
Translation: The names of all I have secured: his path is far: he whom Bay Horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath.

Sanskit Text: तरिः सप्त मयूर्यः सप्त सवसारो अग्रुवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: triḥ sapta mayūryaḥ sapta svasāro aghruvaḥ |
Translation: 14 So have the peahens three-times-seven, so have the maiden Sisters Seven

Sanskit Text: तास्ते विषं वि जभ्रिर उदकं कुम्भिनीरिव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāste viṣaṃ vi jabhrira udakaṃ kumbhinīriva ||
Translation: Carried thy venom far away, as girls bear water in their jars.

Sanskit Text: इयत्तकः कुषुम्भकस्तकं भिनद्म्यश्मना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyattakaḥ kuṣumbhakastakaṃ bhinadmyaśmanā |
Translation: 15 The poison-insect is so small; I crush the creature with a stone.

Sanskit Text: ततो विषं पर वाव्र्ते पराचीरनु संवतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tato viṣaṃ pra vāvṛte parācīranu saṃvataḥ ||
Translation: I turn the poison hence away, departed unto distant lands.

Sanskit Text: कुषुम्भकस्तदब्रवीद गिरेः परवर्तमानकः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kuṣumbhakastadabravīd ghireḥ pravartamānakaḥ |
Translation: 16 Forth issuing from the mountain's side the poison-insect spake and said:

Sanskit Text: वर्श्चिकस्यारसं विषमरसं वर्श्चिक ते विषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛścikasyārasaṃ viṣamarasaṃ vṛścika te viṣam ||
Translation: Scorpion, they venom is but weak.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने दयुभिस्त्वमाशुशुक्षणिस्त्वमद्भ्यस्त्वमश्मनस परि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne dyubhistvamāśuśukṣaṇistvamadbhyastvamaśmanas pari |
Translation: 1. THOU, Agni, shining in thy glory through the days, art brought to life from out the waters, from the stone:

Sanskit Text: तवं वनेभ्यस्त्वमोषधीभ्यस्त्वं नर्णां नर्पते जायसे शुचिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ vanebhyastvamoṣadhībhyastvaṃ nṛṇāṃ nṛpate jāyase śuciḥ ||
Translation: From out the forest trees and herbs that grow on ground, thou, Sovran Lord of men art

Sanskit Text: <a href="errata.htm#8">
generated
pure.
तवाग्ने होत्रं तव पोत्रं रत्वियं तव नेष्ट्रं तवमग्निद रतायतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tavāghne hotraṃ tava potraṃ ṛtviyaṃ tava neṣṭraṃ tvamaghnid ṛtāyataḥ |
Translation: 2 Thine is the Herald's task and Cleanser's duly timed; Leader art thou, and Kindler for the pious man.

Sanskit Text: तव परशास्त्रं तवमध्वरीयसि बरह्मा चासि गर्हपतिश्च नो दमे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava praśāstraṃ tvamadhvarīyasi brahmā cāsi ghṛhapatiśca no dame ||
Translation: Thou art Director, thou the ministering Priest: thou art the Brahman, Lord and Master in our home.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्न इन्द्रो वर्षभः सतामसि तवं विष्णुरुरुगायो नमस्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghna indro vṛṣabhaḥ satāmasi tvaṃ viṣṇururughāyo namasyaḥ |
Translation: 3 Hero of Heroes, Agni! Thou art Indra, thou art Viṣṇu of the Mighty Stride, adorable:

Sanskit Text: तवं बरह्मा रयिविद बरह्मणस पते तवं विधर्तःसचसे पुरन्ध्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ brahmā rayivid brahmaṇas pate tvaṃ vidhartaḥsacase purandhyā ||
Translation: Thou, Brahmaṇaspati, the Brahman finding wealth: thou, O Sustainer, with thy wisdom tendest us.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने राजा वरुणो धर्तव्रतस्त्वं मित्रो भवसि दस्म ईड्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne rājā varuṇo dhṛtavratastvaṃ mitro bhavasi dasma īḍyaḥ |
Translation: 4 Agni, thou art King Varuṇa whose laws stand fast; as Mitra, Wonder-Worker, thou must be implored.

Sanskit Text: तवमर्यमा सत्पतिर्यस्य सम्भुजं तवमंशो विदथे देव भाजयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaryamā satpatiryasya sambhujaṃ tvamaṃśo vidathe deva bhājayuḥ ||
Translation: Aryaman, heroes' Lord, art thou, enriching all, and liberal Aṁśa in the synod, O thou God.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने तवष्टा विधते सुवीर्यं तव गनावो मित्रमहः सजात्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne tvaṣṭā vidhate suvīryaṃ tava ghnāvo mitramahaḥ sajātyam |
Translation: 5 Thou givest strength, as Tvaṣṭar, to the worshipper: thou wielding Mitra's power hast kinship with the Dames.

Sanskit Text: तवमाशुहेमा ररिषे सवश्व्यं तवं नरां शर्धो असि पुरूवसुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamāśuhemā rariṣe svaśvyaṃ tvaṃ narāṃ śardho asi purūvasuḥ ||
Translation: Thou, urging thy fleet coursers, givest noble steeds: a host of heroes art thou with great store of wealth.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने रुद्रो असुरो महो दिवस्त्वं शर्धो मारुतं पर्क्ष ईशिषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne rudro asuro maho divastvaṃ śardho mārutaṃ pṛkṣa īśiṣe |
Translation: 6 Rudra art thou, the Asura of mighty heaven: thou art the Maruts’ host, thou art the Lord of food,

Sanskit Text: तवं वातैररुणैर्यासि शंगयस्त्वं पूषा विधतः पासि नु तमना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ vātairaruṇairyāsi śaṃghayastvaṃ pūṣā vidhataḥ pāsi nu tmanā ||
Translation: Thou goest with red winds: bliss hast thou in thine home. As Pūṣan thou thyself protectest worshippers.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने दरविणोदा अरंक्र्ते तवं देवः सविता रत्नधासि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne draviṇodā araṃkṛte tvaṃ devaḥ savitā ratnadhāasi |
Translation: 7 Giver of wealth art thou to him who honours thee; thou art God Savitar, granter of precious things.

Sanskit Text: तवं भगो नर्पते वस्व ईशिषे तवं पायुर्दमे यस्तेऽविधत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ bhagho nṛpate vasva īśiṣe tvaṃ pāyurdame yaste'vidhat ||
Translation: As Bhaga, Lord of men! thou rulest over wealth, and guardest in his house him who hath served thee well.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने दम आ विश्पतिं विशस्त्वां राजानं सुविदत्रं रञ्जते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne dama ā viśpatiṃ viśastvāṃ rājānaṃ suvidatraṃ ṛñjate |
Translation: 8 To thee, the people's Lord within the house, the folk press forward to their King most graciously inclined.

Sanskit Text: तवं विश्वानि सवनीक पत्यसे तवं सहस्राणि शता दश परति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ viśvāni svanīka patyase tvaṃ sahasrāṇi śatā daśa prati ||
Translation: Lord of the lovely look, all things belong to thee: ten, hundred, yea, a thousand are outweighed by thee.

Sanskit Text: तवामग्ने पितरमिष्टिभिर्नरस्त्वां भरात्राय शम्या तनूरुचम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmaghne pitaramiṣṭibhirnarastvāṃ bhrātrāya śamyā tanūrucam |
Translation: 9 Agni, men seek thee as a Father with their prayers, win thee, bright-formed, to brotherhood with holy act.

Sanskit Text: तवं पुत्रो भवसि यस्ते.अविधत तवं सखा सुशेवः पास्याध्र्षः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ putro bhavasi yaste.avidhat tvaṃ sakhā suśevaḥ pāsyādhṛṣaḥ ||
Translation: Thou art a Son to him who duly worships thee, and as a trusty Friend thou guardest from attack.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्न रभुराके नमस्यस्त्वं वाजस्य कषुमतो राय ईशिषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghna ṛbhurāke namasyastvaṃ vājasya kṣumato rāya īśiṣe |
Translation: 10 A Ṛbhu art thou, Agni, near to be adored thou art the Sovran Lord of foodful spoil and wealth.

Sanskit Text: तवं वि भास्यनु दक्षि दावने तवं विशिक्षुरसियज्ञमातनिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ vi bhāsyanu dakṣi dāvane tvaṃ viśikṣurasiyajñamātaniḥ ||
Translation: Thou shinest brightly forth, thou burnest to bestow: pervading sacrifice, thou lendest us thine help.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने अदितिर्देव दाशुषे तवं होत्रा भारती वर्धसेगिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne aditirdeva dāśuṣe tvaṃ hotrā bhāratī vardhaseghirā |
Translation: 11 Thou, God, art Aditi to him who offers gifts: thou, Hotrā, Bhāratī, art strengthened by the song.

Sanskit Text: तवमिळा षतहिमासि दक्षसे तवं वर्त्रहा वसुपते सरस्वती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamiḷā ṣatahimāsi dakṣase tvaṃ vṛtrahā vasupate sarasvatī ||
Translation: Thou art the hundred-wintered Iḷā to give strength, Lord of Wealth! Vṛtra-slayer and Sarasvatī.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने सुभ्र्त उत्तमं वयस्तव सपार्हे वर्ण आ सन्द्र्शि शरियः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne subhṛta uttamaṃ vayastava spārhe varṇa ā sandṛśi śriyaḥ |
Translation: 12 Thou, Agni, cherished well, art highest vital power; in thy delightful hue are glories visible.

Sanskit Text: तवं वाजः परतरणो बर्हन्नसि तवं रयिर्बहुलो विश्वतस पर्थुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ vājaḥ prataraṇo bṛhannasi tvaṃ rayirbahulo viśvatas pṛthuḥ ||
Translation: Thou art the lofty might that furthers each design: thou art wealth manifold, diffused on every side.

Sanskit Text: तवामग्न आदित्यास आस्यं तवां जिह्वां शुचयश्चक्रिरेकवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmaghna ādityāsa āsyaṃ tvāṃ jihvāṃ śucayaścakrirekave |
Translation: 13 Thee, Agni, have the Ādityas taken as their mouth; the Bright Ones have made thee, O Sage, to be their tongue.

Sanskit Text: तवां रातिषाचो अध्वरेषु सश्चिरे तवे देवा हविरदन्त्याहुतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ rātiṣāco adhvareṣu saścire tve devā haviradantyāhutam ||
Translation: They who love offerings cling to thee at solemn rites: by thee the Gods devour the duly offered food.

Sanskit Text: तवे अग्ने विश्वे अन्र्तासो अद्रुह आसा देवा हविरदन्त्याहुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve aghne viśve anṛtāso adruha āsā devā haviradantyāhutam |
Translation: 14 By thee, O Agni, all the Immortal guileless Gods cat with thy mouth the oblation that is offered them.

Sanskit Text: तवया मर्तासः सवदन्त आसुतिं तवं गर्भो वीरुधां जज्ञिषे शुचिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā martāsaḥ svadanta āsutiṃ tvaṃ gharbho vīrudhāṃ jajñiṣe śuciḥ ||
Translation: By thee do mortal men give sweetness to their drink. Bright art thou born, the embryo of the plants of earth.

Sanskit Text: तवं तान सं च परति चासि मज्मनाग्ने सुजात पर च देवरिच्यसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tān saṃ ca prati cāsi majmanāghne sujāta pra ca devaricyase |
Translation: 15 With these thou art united, Agni; yea thou, God of noble birth, surpassest them in majesty,

Sanskit Text: पर्क्षो यदत्र महिना वि ते भुवदनु दयावाप्र्थिवी रोदसी उभे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛkṣo yadatra mahinā vi te bhuvadanu dyāvāpṛthivī rodasī ubhe ||
Translation: Which, through the power of good, here spreads abroad from thee, diffused through both the worlds, throughout the earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: ये सतोत्र्भ्यो गोग्रामश्वपेशसमग्ने रातिमुपस्र्जन्ति सूरयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye stotṛbhyo ghoaghrāmaśvapeśasamaghne rātimupasṛjanti sūrayaḥ |
Translation: 16 The princely worshippers who send to those who sing thy praise, O Agni, guerdon graced with kine and steeds,—

Sanskit Text: अस्माञ्च तांश्च पर हि नेषि वस्य आ बर्हद वदेम विदथे सुवीराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmāñca tāṃśca pra hi neṣi vasya ā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ ||
Translation: Lead thou both these and us forward to higher bliss. With brave men in the assembly may we speak aloud.

Sanskit Text: समिद्धो अग्निर्निहितः पर्थिव्यां परत्यं विश्वानि भुवनान्यस्थात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samiddho aghnirnihitaḥ pṛthivyāṃ pratyaṃ viśvāni bhuvanānyasthāt |
Translation: 1. AGNI is set upon the earth well kindled; he standeth in the presence of all beings.

Sanskit Text: होता पावकः परदिवः सुमेधा देवो देवान यजत्वग्निरर्हन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotā pāvakaḥ pradivaḥ sumedhā devo devān yajatvaghnirarhan ||
Translation: Wise, ancient, God, the Priest and Purifier, let Agni serve the Gods for he is worthy.

Sanskit Text: नराशंसः परति धामान्यञ्जन तिस्रो दिवः परति मह्ना सवर्चिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: narāśaṃsaḥ prati dhāmānyañjan tisro divaḥ prati mahnā svarciḥ |
Translation: 2 May Narāśaṁsa lighting up the chambers, bright in his majesty through threefold heaven,

Sanskit Text: घर्तप्रुषा मनसा हव्यमुन्दन मूर्धन यज्ञस्य समनक्तु देवान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtapruṣā manasā havyamundan mūrdhan yajñasya samanaktu devān ||
Translation: Steeping the gift with oil diffusing purpose, bedew the Gods at chiefest time of worship.

Sanskit Text: ईळितो अग्ने मनसा नो अर्हन देवान यक्षि मानुषात पूर्वो अद्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īḷito aghne manasā no arhan devān yakṣi mānuṣāt pūrvo adya |
Translation: 3 Adored in heart, as is thy right, O Agni, serve the Gods first to-day before the mortal.

Sanskit Text: स आ वह मरुतां शर्धो अच्युतमिन्द्रं नरो बर्हिषदं यजध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ā vaha marutāṃ śardho acyutamindraṃ naro barhiṣadaṃ yajadhvam ||
Translation: Bring thou the Marut host. Ye men do worship to Indra seated on the grass, eternal.

Sanskit Text: देव बर्हिर्वर्धमानं सुवीरं सतीर्णं राये सुभरं वेद्यस्याम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: deva barhirvardhamānaṃ suvīraṃ stīrṇaṃ rāye subharaṃ vedyasyām |
Translation: 4 O Grass divine, increasing, rich in heroes, strewn for

Sanskit Text: <a href="errata.htm#9">
wealth's
sake, well laid upon this altar,—
घर्तेनाक्तं वसवः सीदतेदं विश्वे देवा आदित्या यज्ञियासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtenāktaṃ vasavaḥ sīdatedaṃ viśve devā ādityā yajñiyāsaḥ ||
Translation: On this bedewed with oil sit ye, O Vasus, sit all ye Gods, ye Holy, ye Ādityas.

Sanskit Text: वि शरयन्तामुर्विया हूयमाना दवारो देवीः सुप्रायणा नमोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi śrayantāmurviyā hūyamānā dvāro devīḥ suprāyaṇā namobhiḥ |
Translation: 5 Wide be the Doors, the Goddesses, thrown open, easy to pass, invoked, through adorations,

Sanskit Text: वयचस्वतीर्वि परथन्तामजुर्या वर्णं पुनानायशसं सुवीरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyacasvatīrvi prathantāmajuryā varṇaṃ punānāyaśasaṃ suvīram ||
Translation: Let them unfold, expansive, everlasting, that sanctify the class famed, rich in heroes.

Sanskit Text: साध्वपांसि सनता न उक्षिते उषासानक्ता वय्येव रण्विते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sādhvapāṃsi sanatā na ukṣite uṣāsānaktā vayyeva raṇvite |
Translation: 6 Good work for us, the glorious Night and Morning, like female weavers, waxen from aforetime,

Sanskit Text: तन्तुं ततं संवयन्ती समीची यज्ञस्य पेशः सुदुघे पयस्वती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tantuṃ tataṃ saṃvayantī samīcī yajñasya peśaḥ sudughe payasvatī ||
Translation: Yielders of rich milk, interweave in concert the long-extended thread, the web of worship.

Sanskit Text: दैव्या होतारा परथमा विदुष्टर रजु यक्षतः सं रचावपुष्टरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: daivyā hotārā prathamā viduṣṭara ṛju yakṣataḥ saṃ ṛcāvapuṣṭarā |
Translation: 7 Let the two heavenly Heralds, first, most wise, most fair, present oblation duly with the sacred verse,

Sanskit Text: देवान यजन्ताव रतुथा समञ्जतो नाभा पर्थिव्या अधि सानुषु तरिषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devān yajantāv ṛtuthā samañjato nābhā pṛthivyā adhi sānuṣu triṣu ||
Translation: Worshipping God at ordered seasons decking them at three high places at the centre of the earth.

Sanskit Text: सरस्वती साधयन्ती धियं न इळा देवी भारती विश्वतूर्तिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarasvatī sādhayantī dhiyaṃ na iḷā devī bhāratī viśvatūrtiḥ |
Translation: 8 Sarasvatī who perfects our devotion, Iḷā divine, Bhāratī all surpassing,—

Sanskit Text: तिस्रो देवीः सवधया बर्हिरेदमछिद्रं पान्तुशरणं निषद्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisro devīḥ svadhayā barhiredamachidraṃ pāntuśaraṇaṃ niṣadya ||
Translation: Three Goddesses, with power inherent, seated, protect this holy Grass, our flawless refuge!

Sanskit Text: पिशङगरूपः सुभरो वयोधाः शरुष्टी वीरो जायते देवकामः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: piśaṅgharūpaḥ subharo vayodhāḥ śruṣṭī vīro jāyate devakāmaḥ |
Translation: 9 Born is the pious hero swift of hearing, like gold in hue, well formed, and full of vigour.

Sanskit Text: परजां तवष्टा वि षयतु नाभिमस्मे अथा देवानामप्येतु पाथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prajāṃ tvaṣṭā vi ṣyatu nābhimasme athā devānāmapyetu pāthaḥ ||
Translation: May Tvaṣṭar lengthen our line and kindred, and may they reach the place which Gods inhabit.

Sanskit Text: वनस्पतिरवस्र्जन्नुप सथादग्निर्हविः सूदयाति पर धीभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanaspatiravasṛjannupa sthādaghnirhaviḥ sūdayāti pra dhībhiḥ |
Translation: 10 Vanaspati shall stand anear and start us, and Agni with his arts prepare oblation.

Sanskit Text: तरिधा समक्तं नयतु परजानन देवेभ्यो दैव्यः शमितोप हव्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tridhā samaktaṃ nayatu prajānan devebhyo daivyaḥ śamitopa havyam ||
Translation: Let the skilled heavenly Immolator forward unto the Gods the offering thrice anointed.

Sanskit Text: घर्तं मिमिक्षे घर्तमस्य योनिर्घ्र्ते शरितो घर्तं वस्य धाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtaṃ mimikṣe ghṛtamasya yonirghṛte śrito ghṛtaṃ vasya dhāma |
Translation: 11 Oil has been mixt: oil is his habitation. In oil he rests: oil is his proper province.

Sanskit Text: अनुष्वधमा वह मादयस्व सवाहाक्र्तं वर्षभ वक्षि हव्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anuṣvadhamā vaha mādayasva svāhākṛtaṃ vṛṣabha vakṣi havyam ||
Translation: Come as thy wont is: O thou Steer, rejoice thee; bear off the oblation duly consecrated.

Sanskit Text: हुवे वः सुद्योत्मानं सुव्र्क्तिं विशामग्निमतिथिं सुप्रयसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: huve vaḥ sudyotmānaṃ suvṛktiṃ viśāmaghnimatithiṃ suprayasam |
Translation: 1. FOR you I call the glorious refulgent Agni, the guest of men, rich in oblations

Sanskit Text: मित्र इव यो दिधिषाय्यो भूद देव आदेवे जने जातवेदाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitra iva yo didhiṣāyyo bhūd deva ādeve jane jātavedāḥ ||
Translation: Whom all must strive to win even as a lover, God among godly people, Jātavedas.

Sanskit Text: इमं विधन्तो अपां सधस्थे दवितादधुर्भ्र्गवो विक्ष्वायोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ vidhanto apāṃ sadhasthe dvitādadhurbhṛghavo vikṣvāyoḥ |
Translation: 2 Bhṛgus who served him in the home of waters set him of old in houses of the living.

Sanskit Text: एष विश्वान्यभ्यस्तु भूमा देवानामग्निररतिर्जीराश्वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa viśvānyabhyastu bhūmā devānāmaghniraratirjīrāśvaḥ ||
Translation: Over all worlds let Agni be the Sovran, the messenger of Gods with rapid coursers.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं देवासो मानुषीषु विक्षु परियं धुः कषेष्यन्तो नमित्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ devāso mānuṣīṣu vikṣu priyaṃ dhuḥ kṣeṣyanto namitram |
Translation: 3 Among the tribes of men the Gods placed Agni as a dear Friend when they would dwell among them.

Sanskit Text: स दीदयदुशतीरूर्म्या आ दक्षाय्यो यो दास्वते दम आ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa dīdayaduśatīrūrmyā ā dakṣāyyo yo dāsvate dama ā ||
Translation: Against the longing nights may he shine brightly, and show the offerer in the house his vigour.

Sanskit Text: अस्य रण्वा सवस्येव पुष्टिः सन्द्र्ष्टिरस्य हियानस्य दक्षोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya raṇvā svasyeva puṣṭiḥ sandṛṣṭirasya hiyānasya dakṣoḥ |
Translation: 4 Sweet is his growth as of one's own possessions; his look when rushing fain to burn is lovely.

Sanskit Text: वि यो भरिभ्रदोषधीषु जिह्वामत्यो न रथ्यो दोधवीति वारान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yo bharibhradoṣadhīṣu jihvāmatyo na rathyo dodhavīti vārān ||
Translation: He darts his tongue forth, like a harnessed courser who shakes his flowing tail, among the bushes.

Sanskit Text: आ यन मे अभ्वं वनदः पनन्तोशिग्भ्यो नामिमीत वर्णम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yan me abhvaṃ vanadaḥ panantośighbhyo nāmimīta varṇam |
Translation: 5 Since they who honour me have praised my greatness,—he gave, as ’twere, his hue to those who love him.

Sanskit Text: स चित्रेण चिकिते रंसु भासा जुजुर्वान यो मुहुरा युवा भूत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa citreṇa cikite raṃsu bhāsā jujurvān yo muhurā yuvā bhūt ||
Translation: Known is he by his bright delightful splendour, and waxing old renews his youth for ever.

Sanskit Text: आ यो वना तात्र्षाणो न भाति वार्ण पथा रथ्येवस्वानीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yo vanā tātṛṣāṇo na bhāti vārṇa pathā rathyevasvānīt |
Translation: 6 Like one athirst, he lighteth up the forests; like water down the chariot ways he roareth.

Sanskit Text: कर्ष्णाध्वा तपू रण्वश्चिकेत दयौरिव समयमानो नभोभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṣṇādhvā tapū raṇvaściketa dyauriva smayamāno nabhobhiḥ ||
Translation: On his black path he shines in burning beauty, marked as it were the heaven that smiles through vapour.

Sanskit Text: स यो वयस्थादभि दक्षदुर्वीं पशुर्नैति सवयुरगोपाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa yo vyasthādabhi dakṣadurvīṃ paśurnaiti svayuraghopāḥ |
Translation: 7 Around, consuming the broad earth, he wanders, free roaming like an ox without a herdsman,—

Sanskit Text: अग्निः शोचिष्मानतसान्युष्णन कर्ष्णव्यथिरस्वदयन न भूम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniḥ śociṣmānatasānyuṣṇan kṛṣṇavyathirasvadayan na bhūma ||
Translation: Agni refulgent, burning up the bushes, with blackened lines, as though the earth he seasoned.

Sanskit Text: नू ते पूर्वस्यावसो अधीतौ तर्तीये विदथे मन्म शंसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū te pūrvasyāvaso adhītau tṛtīye vidathe manma śaṃsi |
Translation: 8 I, in remembrance of thine ancient favour have sung my hymn in this our third assembly.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे अग्ने संयद्वीरं बर्हन्तं कषुमन्तं वाजं सवपत्यंरयिं दाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme aghne saṃyadvīraṃ bṛhantaṃ kṣumantaṃ vājaṃ svapatyaṃrayiṃ dāḥ ||
Translation: O Agni, give us wealth with store of heroes and mighty strength in food and noble offspring.

Sanskit Text: तवया यथा गर्त्समदासो अग्ने गुहा वन्वन्त उपरानभि षयुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā yathā ghṛtsamadāso aghne ghuhā vanvanta uparānabhi ṣyuḥ |
Translation: 9 May the Gṛtsamadas, serving in secret, through thee, O Agni, overcome their neighbours,

Sanskit Text: सुवीरासो अभिमातिषाहः समत सूरिभ्यो गर्णते तद वयो धाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvīrāso abhimātiṣāhaḥ smat sūribhyo ghṛṇate tad vayo dhāḥ ||
Translation: Rich in good heroes and subduing foemen. That vital power give thou to chiefs and singers.

Sanskit Text: इमां मे अग्ने समिधमिमामुपसदं वनेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imāṃ me aghne samidhamimāmupasadaṃ vaneḥ |
Translation: 1. AGNI, accept this flaming brand, this waiting with my prayer on thee:

Sanskit Text: इमा उ षु शरुधी गिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā u ṣu śrudhī ghiraḥ ||
Translation: Hear graciously these songs of praise.

Sanskit Text: अया ते अग्ने विधेमोर्जो नपादश्वमिष्टे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayā te aghne vidhemorjo napādaśvamiṣṭe |
Translation: 2 With this hymn let us honour thee, seeker of horses, Son of Strength,

Sanskit Text: एना सूक्तेन सुजात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: enā sūktena sujāta ||
Translation: With this fair hymn, thou nobly born.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा गीर्भिर्गिर्वणसं दरविणस्युं दरविणोदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā ghīrbhirghirvaṇasaṃ draviṇasyuṃ draviṇodaḥ |
Translation: 3 As such, lover of song, with songs, wealth-lover, giver of our wealth!

Sanskit Text: सपर्येम सपर्यवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saparyema saparyavaḥ ||
Translation: With reverence let us worship thee.

Sanskit Text: स बोधि सूरिर्मघवा वसुपते वसुदावन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa bodhi sūrirmaghavā vasupate vasudāvan |
Translation: 4 Be thou for us a liberal Prince, giver and Lord of precious things.

Sanskit Text: युयोध्यस्मद दवेषांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuyodhyasmad dveṣāṃsi ||
Translation: Drive those who hate us far away.

Sanskit Text: स नो वर्ष्तिं दिवस परि स नो वाजमनर्वाणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no vṛṣtiṃ divas pari sa no vājamanarvāṇam |
Translation: 5 Such as thou art, give rain from heaven, give strength which no man may resist:

Sanskit Text: स नः सहस्रिणीरिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ sahasriṇīriṣaḥ ||
Translation: Give food exceeding plentiful.

Sanskit Text: ईळानायावस्यवे यविष्ठ दूत नो गिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īḷānāyāvasyave yaviṣṭha dūta no ghirā |
Translation: 6 To him who lauds thee, craving help, most youthful envoy! through our song,

Sanskit Text: यजिष्ठ होतरा गहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajiṣṭha hotarā ghahi ||
Translation: Most holy Herald! come thou nigh.

Sanskit Text: अन्तर्ह्यग्न ईयसे विद्वान जन्मोभया कवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: antarhyaghna īyase vidvān janmobhayā kave |
Translation: 7 Between both races, Agni, Sage, well skilled thou passest to and fro,

Sanskit Text: दूतो जन्येवमित्र्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūto janyevamitryaḥ ||
Translation: As envoy friendly to mankind.

Sanskit Text: स विद्वाना च पिप्रयो यक्षि चिकित्व आनुषक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vidvānā ca piprayo yakṣi cikitva ānuṣak |
Translation: 8 Befriend us thou as knowing all. Sage, duly worship thou the Gods,

Sanskit Text: आ चास्मिन सत्सि बर्हिषि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā cāsmin satsi barhiṣi ||
Translation: And seat thee on this sacred grass.

Sanskit Text: शरेष्ठं यविष्ठ भारताग्ने दयुमन्तमा भर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śreṣṭhaṃ yaviṣṭha bhāratāghne dyumantamā bhara |
Translation: 1. VASU, thou most youthful God, Bhārata, Agni, bring us wealth,

Sanskit Text: वसो पुरुस्प्र्हं रयिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaso puruspṛhaṃ rayim ||
Translation: Excellent, splendid, much-desired.

Sanskit Text: मा नो अरातिरीशत देवस्य मर्त्यस्य च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no arātirīśata devasya martyasya ca |
Translation: 2 Let no malignity prevail against us, either God's or man's.

Sanskit Text: पर्षि तस्या उतद्विषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parṣi tasyā utadviṣaḥ ||
Translation: Save us from this and enmity.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा उत तवया वयं धारा उदन्या इव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā uta tvayā vayaṃ dhārā udanyā iva |
Translation: 3 So through thy favour may we force through all our enemies a way,

Sanskit Text: अति गाहेमहि दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ati ghāhemahi dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: As ’twere through streaming water-floods.

Sanskit Text: शुचिः पावक वन्द्यो.अग्ने बर्हद वि रोचसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuciḥ pāvaka vandyo.aghne bṛhad vi rocase |
Translation: 4 Thou, Purifier Agni, high shinest forth, bright, adorable,

Sanskit Text: तवं घर्तेभिराहुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ ghṛtebhirāhutaḥ ||
Translation: When worshipped with the sacred oil.

Sanskit Text: तवं नो असि भारताग्ने वशाभिरुक्षभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ no asi bhāratāghne vaśābhirukṣabhiḥ |
Translation: 5 Ours art thou, Agni, Bhārata, honoured by us with barren cows,

Sanskit Text: अष्टापदीभिराहुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṣṭāpadībhirāhutaḥ ||
Translation: With bullocks and with kine in calf

Sanskit Text: दर्वन्नः सर्पिरासुतिः परत्नो होता वरेण्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: drvannaḥ sarpirāsutiḥ pratno hotā vareṇyaḥ |
Translation: 6 Wood-fed, bedewed with sacred oil, ancient, Invoker, excellent,

Sanskit Text: सहसस पुत्रो अद्भुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasas putro adbhutaḥ ||
Translation: The Son of Strength, the Wonderful.

Sanskit Text: वाजयन्निव नू रथान योगानग्नेरुप सतुहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājayanniva nū rathān yoghānaghnerupa stuhi |
Translation: 1. Now praise, as one who strives for strength, the harnessing of Agni's car,

Sanskit Text: यशस्तमस्य मीळ्हुषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaśastamasya mīḷhuṣaḥ ||
Translation: The liberal, the most splendid One;

Sanskit Text: यः सुनीथो ददाशुषे.अजुर्यो जरयन्नरिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ sunītho dadāśuṣe.ajuryo jarayannarim |
Translation: 2 Who, guiding worshippers aright, withers, untouched by age, the foe:

Sanskit Text: चारुप्रतीकाहुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cārupratīkaāhutaḥ ||
Translation: When worshipped fair to look upon;

Sanskit Text: य उ शरिया दमेष्वा दोषोषसि परशस्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya u śriyā dameṣvā doṣoṣasi praśasyate |
Translation: 3 Who for his glory is extolled at eve and morning in our homes,

Sanskit Text: यस्य वरतं न मीयते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya vrataṃ na mīyate ||
Translation: Whose statute is inviolate;

Sanskit Text: आ यः सवर्ण भानुना चित्रो विभात्यर्चिषा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yaḥ svarṇa bhānunā citro vibhātyarciṣā |
Translation: 4 Who shines refulgent like the Sun, with brilliance and with fiery flame,

Sanskit Text: अञ्जानोजरैरभि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: añjānoajarairabhi ||
Translation: Decked with imperishable sheen.

Sanskit Text: अत्रिमनु सवराज्यमग्निमुक्थानि वाव्र्धुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrimanu svarājyamaghnimukthāni vāvṛdhuḥ |
Translation: 5 Him Atri, Agni, have our songs Strengthened according to his sway:

Sanskit Text: विश्वा अधि शरियो दधे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā adhi śriyo dadhe ||
Translation: All glories hath he made his own.

Sanskit Text: अग्नेरिन्द्रस्य सोमस्य देवानामूतिभिर्वयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnerindrasya somasya devānāmūtibhirvayam |
Translation: 6 May we with Agni's, Indra's help, with Soma's, yea, of all the Gods,

Sanskit Text: अरिष्यन्तःसचेमह्यभि षयाम पर्तन्यतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ariṣyantaḥsacemahyabhi ṣyāma pṛtanyataḥ ||
Translation: Uninjured dwell together still, and conquer those who fight with us.

Sanskit Text: नि होता होत्र्षदने विदानस्त्वेषो दीदिवानसदत सुदक्षः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni hotā hotṛṣadane vidānastveṣo dīdivānasadat sudakṣaḥ |
