Translation: 1. ACCUSTOMED to the Herald's place, the Herald hath seated him, bright, splendid, passing mighty,

Sanskit Text: अदब्धव्रतप्रमतिर्वसिष्ठः सहस्रम्भरः शुचिजिह्वो अग्निः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adabdhavratapramatirvasiṣṭhaḥ sahasrambharaḥ śucijihvo aghniḥ ||
Translation: Whose foresight keeps the Law from violation, excellent, pure-tongued, bringing thousands, Agni.

Sanskit Text: तवं दूतस्त्वमु नः परस्पास्त्वं वस्य आ वर्षभ परणेता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ dūtastvamu naḥ paraspāstvaṃ vasya ā vṛṣabha praṇetā |
Translation: 2 Envoy art thou, protector from the foeman, strong God, thou leadest us to higher blessings.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने तोकस्य नस्तने तनूनामप्रयुछन दीद्यद बोधि गोपाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne tokasya nastane tanūnāmaprayuchan dīdyad bodhi ghopāḥ ||
Translation: Refulgent, be an ever-heedful keeper, Agni, for us and for our seed offspring.

Sanskit Text: विधेम ते परमे जन्मन्नग्ने विधेम सतोमैरवरे सधस्थे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidhema te parame janmannaghne vidhema stomairavare sadhasthe |
Translation: 3 May we adore thee in thy loftiest birthplace, and, with our praises, in thy lower station.

Sanskit Text: यस्माद योनेरुदारिथा यजे तं पर तवे हवींषि जुहुरेसमिद्धे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasmād yonerudārithā yaje taṃ pra tve havīṃṣi juhuresamiddhe ||
Translation: The place whence thou issued forth I worship: to thee well kindled have they paid oblations.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने यजस्व हविषा यजीयाञ्छ्रुष्टी देष्णमभि गर्णीहि राधः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne yajasva haviṣā yajīyāñchruṣṭī deṣṇamabhi ghṛṇīhi rādhaḥ |
Translation: 4 Agni, best Priest, pay worship with oblation; quickly commend the gift to be presented;

Sanskit Text: तवं हयसि रयिपती रयीणां तवं शुक्रस्य वचसो मनोता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hyasi rayipatī rayīṇāṃ tvaṃ śukrasya vacaso manotā ||
Translation: For thou art Lord of gathered wealth and treasure. of the bright song of praise thou art inventor.

Sanskit Text: उभयं ते न कषीयते वसव्यं दिवे-दिवे जायमानस्य दस्म |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhayaṃ te na kṣīyate vasavyaṃ dive-dive jāyamānasya dasma |
Translation: 5 The twofold opulence, O Wonder-Worker, of thee new-born each day never decreases.

Sanskit Text: कर्धि कषुमन्तं जरितारमग्ने कर्धि पतिं सवपत्यस्य रायः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛdhi kṣumantaṃ jaritāramaghne kṛdhi patiṃ svapatyasya rāyaḥ ||
Translation: Enrich with food the man who lauds thee, Agni: make him the lord of wealth with noble offspring.

Sanskit Text: सैनानीकेन सुविदत्रो अस्मे यष्टा देवानायजिष्ठः सवस्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sainānīkena suvidatro asme yaṣṭā devānāyajiṣṭhaḥ svasti |
Translation: 6 May he, benevolent with this fair aspect, best sacrificer, bring the Gods to bless us.

Sanskit Text: अदब्धो गोपा उत नः परस्पा अग्ने दयुमदुत रेवद दिदीहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adabdho ghopā uta naḥ paraspā aghne dyumaduta revad didīhi ||
Translation: Sure guardian, our protector from the foemen, shine, Agni, with thine affluence and splendour.

Sanskit Text: जोहूत्रो अग्निः परथमः पितेवेळस पदे मनुषा यत समिद्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: johūtro aghniḥ prathamaḥ piteveḷas pade manuṣā yat samiddhaḥ |
Translation: 1. AGNI, first, loudly calling, like a Father, kindled by man upon the seat of worship.

Sanskit Text: शरियं वसानो अम्र्तो विचेता मर्म्र्जेन्यः शरवस्यःस वाजी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śriyaṃ vasāno amṛto vicetā marmṛjenyaḥ śravasyaḥsa vājī ||
Translation: Clothed in his glory, deathless, keen of insight, must be adorned by all, the Strong, the Famous.

Sanskit Text: शरूया अग्निश्चित्रभानुर्हवं मे विश्वाभिर्गीर्भिरम्र्तो विचेताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrūyā aghniścitrabhānurhavaṃ me viśvābhirghīrbhiramṛto vicetāḥ |
Translation: 2 May Agni the resplendent hear my calling through all my songs, Immortal, keen of insight.

Sanskit Text: शयावा रथं वहतो रोहिता वोतारुषाह चक्रे विभ्र्त्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śyāvā rathaṃ vahato rohitā votāruṣāha cakre vibhṛtraḥ ||
Translation: Dark steeds or ruddy draw his car, or carried in sundry ways he makes them red of colour.

Sanskit Text: उत्तानायामजनयन सुषूतं भुवदग्निः पुरुपेशासु गर्भः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uttānāyāmajanayan suṣūtaṃ bhuvadaghniḥ purupeśāsu gharbhaḥ |
Translation: 3 On wood supine they got the well-formed Infant: a germ in various-fashioned plants was Agni;

Sanskit Text: शिरिणायां चिदक्तुना महोभिरपरीव्र्तो वसति परचेताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śiriṇāyāṃ cidaktunā mahobhiraparīvṛto vasati pracetāḥ ||
Translation: And in the night, not compassed round by darkness, he dwells exceeding wise, with rays of splendour.

Sanskit Text: जिघर्म्यग्निं हविषा घर्तेन परतिक्षियन्तं भुवनानि विश्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jigharmyaghniṃ haviṣā ghṛtena pratikṣiyantaṃ bhuvanāni viśvā |
Translation: 4 With oil and sacred gifts I sprinkle Agni who makes his home in front of all things living,

Sanskit Text: पर्थुं तिरश्चा वयसा बर्हन्तं वयचिष्ठमन्नै रभसं दर्शानम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛthuṃ tiraścā vayasā bṛhantaṃ vyaciṣṭhamannai rabhasaṃ dṛśānam ||
Translation: Broad, vast, through vital power o’er all expanded, conspicuous, strong with all the food that feeds him.

Sanskit Text: आ विश्वतः परत्यञ्चं जिघर्म्यरक्षसा मनसा तज्जुषेत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā viśvataḥ pratyañcaṃ jigharmyarakṣasā manasā tajjuṣeta |
Translation: 5 I pour to him who looks in all directions: may he accept it with a friendly spirit.

Sanskit Text: मर्यश्रीः सप्र्हयद्वर्णो अग्निर्नाभिम्र्शे तन्वा जर्भुराणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maryaśrīḥ spṛhayadvarṇo aghnirnābhimṛśe tanvā jarbhurāṇaḥ ||
Translation: Agni with bridegroom's grace and lovely colour may not be touched when all his form is fury.

Sanskit Text: जञेया भागं सहसानो वरेण तवादूतासो मनुवद वदेम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jñeyā bhāghaṃ sahasāno vareṇa tvādūtāso manuvad vadema |
Translation: 6 By choice victorious, recognize thy portion: with thee for envoy may we speak like Manu.

Sanskit Text: अनूनमग्निं जुह्वा वचस्या मधुप्र्चं धनसाजोहवीमि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anūnamaghniṃ juhvā vacasyā madhupṛcaṃ dhanasājohavīmi ||
Translation: Obtaining wealth, I call on perfect Agni who with an eloquent tongue dispenses sweetness.

Sanskit Text: शरुधी हवमिन्द्र मा रिशण्यः सयाम ते दावने वसूनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrudhī havamindra mā riśaṇyaḥ syāma te dāvane vasūnām |
Translation: 1. HEAR thou my call, O Indra; be not heedless: thine may we be for thee to give us treasures;

Sanskit Text: इमा हि तवामूर्जो वर्धयन्ति वसूयवः सिन्धवो न कषरन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā hi tvāmūrjo vardhayanti vasūyavaḥ sindhavo na kṣarantaḥ ||
Translation: For these presented viands, seeking riches, increase thy strength like streams of water flowing.

Sanskit Text: सर्जो महीरिन्द्र या अपिन्वः परिष्ठिता अहिना शूर पूर्वीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sṛjo mahīrindra yā apinvaḥ pariṣṭhitā ahinā śūra pūrvīḥ |
Translation: 2 Floods great and many, compassed by the Dragon, thou badest swell and settest free, O Hero.

Sanskit Text: अमर्त्यं चिद दासं मन्यमानमवाभिनदुक्थैर्वाव्र्धानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: amartyaṃ cid dāsaṃ manyamānamavābhinadukthairvāvṛdhānaḥ ||
Translation: Strengthened by songs of praise thou rentest piecemeal the Dāsa, him who deemed himself immortal.

Sanskit Text: उक्थेष्विन नु शूर येषु चाकन सतोमेष्विन्द्र रुद्रियेषु च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uktheṣvin nu śūra yeṣu cākan stomeṣvindra rudriyeṣu ca |
Translation: 3 For, Hero, in the lauds wherein thou joyedst, in hymns of praise, O Indra, songs of Rudras,

Sanskit Text: तुभ्येदेता यासु मन्दसानः पर वायवे सिस्रते न शुभ्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyedetā yāsu mandasānaḥ pra vāyave sisrate na śubhrāḥ ||
Translation: These streams in which is thy delight approach thee, even as the brilliant ones draw near to Vāyu.

Sanskit Text: शुभ्रं नु ते शुष्मं वर्धयन्तः शुभ्रं वज्रं बाह्वोर्दधानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śubhraṃ nu te śuṣmaṃ vardhayantaḥ śubhraṃ vajraṃ bāhvordadhānāḥ |
Translation: 4 We who add strength to thine own splendid vigour, laying within thine arms the splendid thunder—

Sanskit Text: शुभ्रस्त्वमिन्द्र वाव्र्धानो अस्मे दासीर्विशः सूर्येण सह्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śubhrastvamindra vāvṛdhāno asme dāsīrviśaḥ sūryeṇa sahyāḥ ||
Translation: With us mayst thou, O Indra, waxen splendid, with Sūrya overcome the Dāsa races.

Sanskit Text: गुहा हितं गुह्यं गूळ्हमप्स्वपीव्र्तं मायिनं कषियन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghuhā hitaṃ ghuhyaṃ ghūḷhamapsvapīvṛtaṃ māyinaṃ kṣiyantam |
Translation: 5 Hero, thou slewest in thy valour Ahi concealed in depths, mysterious, great enchanter,

Sanskit Text: उतो अपो दयां तस्तभ्वांसमहन्नहिं शूर वीर्येण ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto apo dyāṃ tastabhvāṃsamahannahiṃ śūra vīryeṇa ||
Translation: Dwelling enveloped deep within the waters, him who checked heaven and stayed the floods from flowing.

Sanskit Text: सतवा नु त इन्द्र पूर्व्या महान्युत सतवाम नूतना कर्तानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stavā nu ta indra pūrvyā mahānyuta stavāma nūtanā kṛtāni |
Translation: 6 Indra, we laud thy great deeds wrought aforetime, we laud thine exploits later of achievement;

Sanskit Text: सतवा वज्रं बाह्वोरुशन्तं सतवा हरी सूर्यस्य केतू ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stavā vajraṃ bāhvoruśantaṃ stavā harī sūryasya ketū ||
Translation: We laud the bolt that in thine arms lies eager; we laud thy two Bay Steeds, heralds of Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: हरी नु त इन्द्र वाजयन्ता घर्तश्चुतं सवारमस्वार्ष्टाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: harī nu ta indra vājayantā ghṛtaścutaṃ svāramasvārṣṭām |
Translation: 7 Indra, thy Bay Steeds showing forth their vigour have sent a loud cry out that droppeth fatness.

Sanskit Text: वि समना भूमिरप्रथिष्टारंस्त पर्वतश्चित सरिष्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi samanā bhūmiraprathiṣṭāraṃsta parvataścit sariṣyan ||
Translation: The earth hath spread herself in all her fulness: the cloud that was about to move hath rested.

Sanskit Text: नि पर्वतः साद्यप्रयुछन सं मात्र्भिर्वावशानो अक्रान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni parvataḥ sādyaprayuchan saṃ mātṛbhirvāvaśāno akrān |
Translation: 8 Down, never ceasing, hath the rain-cloud settled: bellowing, it hath wandered with the Mothers.

Sanskit Text: दूरे पारे वाणीं वर्धयन्त इन्द्रेषितां धमनिं पप्रथन नि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūre pāre vāṇīṃ vardhayanta indreṣitāṃ dhamaniṃ paprathan ni ||
Translation: Swelling the roar in the far distant limits, they have spread wide the blast sent forth by Indra.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो महां सिन्धुमाशयानं मायाविनं वर्त्रमस्फुरन निः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro mahāṃ sindhumāśayānaṃ māyāvinaṃ vṛtramasphuran niḥ |
Translation: 9 Indra hath hurled down the magician Vṛtra who lay beleaguering the mighty river.

Sanskit Text: अरेजेतां रोदसी भियाने कनिक्रदतो वर्ष्णो अस्य वज्रात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arejetāṃ rodasī bhiyāne kanikradato vṛṣṇo asya vajrāt ||
Translation: Then both the heaven and earth trembled in terror at the strong Hero's thunder when he bellowed.

Sanskit Text: अरोरवीद वर्ष्णो अस्य वज्रो.अमानुषं यन मानुषो निजूर्वात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aroravīd vṛṣṇo asya vajro.amānuṣaṃ yan mānuṣo nijūrvāt |
Translation: 10 Loud roared the mighty Hero's bolt of thunder, when he, the Friend of man, burnt up the monster,

Sanskit Text: नि मायिनो दानवस्य माया अपादयत पपिवान सुतस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni māyino dānavasya māyā apādayat papivān sutasya ||
Translation: And, having drunk his fill of flowing Soma, baffled the guileful Dānava's devices.

Sanskit Text: पिबा-पिबेदिन्द्र शूर सोमं मन्दन्तु तवा मन्दिनः सुतासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibā-pibedindra śūra somaṃ mandantu tvā mandinaḥ sutāsaḥ |
Translation: 11 Drink thou, O Hero Indra, drink the Soma; let the joy-giving juices make thee joyful.

Sanskit Text: पर्णन्तस्ते कुक्षी वर्धयन्त्वित्था सुतः पौर इन्द्रमाव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛṇantaste kukṣī vardhayantvitthā sutaḥ paura indramāva ||
Translation: They, filling both thy flanks, shall swell thy vigour. The juice that satisfies hath helped Indra.

Sanskit Text: तवे इन्द्राप्यभूम विप्रा धियं वनेम रतया सपन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve indrāpyabhūma viprā dhiyaṃ vanema ṛtayā sapantaḥ |
Translation: 12 Singers have we become with thee, O Indra: may we serve duly and prepare devotion.

Sanskit Text: अवस्यवो धीमहि परशस्तिं सद्यस्ते रायो दावने सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avasyavo dhīmahi praśastiṃ sadyaste rāyo dāvane syāma ||
Translation: Seeking thy help we meditate thy praises: may we at once enjoy thy gift of riches.

Sanskit Text: सयाम ते त इन्द्र ये त ऊती अवस्यव ऊर्जं वर्धयन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: syāma te ta indra ye ta ūtī avasyava ūrjaṃ vardhayantaḥ |
Translation: 13 May we be thine, such by thy help, O Indra, as swell thy vigour while they seek thy favour.

Sanskit Text: शुष्मिन्तमं यं चाकनाम देवास्मे रयिं रासि वीरवन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuṣmintamaṃ yaṃ cākanāma devāsme rayiṃ rāsi vīravantam ||
Translation: Give us, thou God, the riches that we long for, most powerful, with stare of noble children.

Sanskit Text: रासि कषयं रासि मित्रमस्मे रासि शर्ध इन्द्र मारुतंनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāsi kṣayaṃ rāsi mitramasme rāsi śardha indra mārutaṃnaḥ |
Translation: 14 Give us a friend, give us an habitation; Indra, give us the company of Maruts,

Sanskit Text: सजोषसो ये च मन्दसानाः पर वायवः पान्त्यग्रणीतिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣaso ye ca mandasānāḥ pra vāyavaḥ pāntyaghraṇītim ||
Translation: And those whose minds accord with theirs, the Vāyus, who drink the first libation of the Soma.

Sanskit Text: वयन्त्विन नु येषु मन्दसानस्त्र्पत सोमं पाहि दरह्यदिन्द्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyantvin nu yeṣu mandasānastṛpat somaṃ pāhi drahyadindra |
Translation: 15 Let those enjoy in whom thou art delighted. Indra, drink Soma for thy strength and gladness.

Sanskit Text: अस्मान सु पर्त्स्वा तरुत्रावर्धयो दयां बर्हद्भिरर्कैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmān su pṛtsvā tarutrāvardhayo dyāṃ bṛhadbhirarkaiḥ ||
Translation: Thou hast exalted us to heaven, Preserver, in battles, through the lofty hymns that praise thee.

Sanskit Text: बर्हन्त इन नु ये ते तरुत्रोक्थेभिर्वा सुम्नमाविवासान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhanta in nu ye te tarutrokthebhirvā sumnamāvivāsān |
Translation: 16 Great, verily, are they, O thou Protector, who by their songs of praise have won the blessing.

Sanskit Text: सत्र्णानासो बर्हिः पस्त्यावत तवोता इदिन्द्र वाजमग्मन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stṛṇānāso barhiḥ pastyāvat tvotā idindra vājamaghman ||
Translation: They who strew sacred grass to be thy dwelling, helped by thee have got them strength, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: उग्रेष्विन नु शूर मन्दसानस्त्रिकद्रुकेषु पाहि सोममिन्द्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughreṣvin nu śūra mandasānastrikadrukeṣu pāhi somamindra |
Translation: 17 Upon the great Trikadruka days, Hero, rejoicing thee, O Indra, drink the Soma.

Sanskit Text: परदोधुवच्छ्मश्रुषु परीणानो याहि हरिभ्यां सुतस्यपीतिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pradodhuvacchmaśruṣu prīṇāno yāhi haribhyāṃ sutasyapītim ||
Translation: Come with Bay Steeds to drink of libation, shaking the drops from out thy beard, contented.

Sanskit Text: धिष्वा शवः शूर येन वर्त्रमवाभिनद दानुमौर्णवाभम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiṣvā śavaḥ śūra yena vṛtramavābhinad dānumaurṇavābham |
Translation: 18 Hero, assume the might wherewith thou clavest Vṛtra piecemeal, the Dānava Aurṇavābha.

Sanskit Text: अपाव्र्णोर्ज्योतिरार्याय नि सव्यतः सादि दस्युरिन्द्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāvṛṇorjyotirāryāya ni savyataḥ sādi dasyurindra ||
Translation: Thou hast disclosed the light to light the Ārya: on thy left hand, O Indra, sank the Dasyu.

Sanskit Text: सनेम ये त ऊतिभिस्तरन्तो विश्वा सप्र्ध आर्येण दस्यून |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanema ye ta ūtibhistaranto viśvā spṛdha āryeṇa dasyūn |
Translation: 19 May we gain wealth, subduing with thy succour and with the Ārya, all our foes, the Dasyus.

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं तत तवाष्ट्रं विश्वरूपमरन्धयः साख्यस्य तरिताय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ tat tvāṣṭraṃ viśvarūpamarandhayaḥ sākhyasya tritāya ||
Translation: Our gain was that to Tṛta of our party thou gavest up Tvaṣṭar's son Viśvarūpa.

Sanskit Text: अस्य सुवानस्य मन्दिनस्त्रितस्य नयर्बुदं वाव्र्धानो अस्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya suvānasya mandinastritasya nyarbudaṃ vāvṛdhāno astaḥ |
Translation: 20 He cast down Arbuda what time his vigour was strengthened by libations poured by Tṛta.

Sanskit Text: अवर्तयत सूर्यो न चक्रं भिनद वलमिन्द्रो अङगिरस्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avartayat sūryo na cakraṃ bhinad valamindro aṅghirasvān ||
Translation: Indra sent forth his whirling wheel like Sūrya, and aided by the Aṅgirases rent Vala.

Sanskit Text: नूनं सा ते परति वरं जरित्रे दुहीयदिन्द्र दक्षिणा मघोनी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nūnaṃ sā te prati varaṃ jaritre duhīyadindra dakṣiṇā maghonī |
Translation: 21 Now let that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee.

Sanskit Text: शिक्षा सतोत्र्भ्यो माति धग भगो नो बर्हद वदेम व. स. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śikṣā stotṛbhyo māti dhagh bhagho no bṛhad vadema v. s. ||
Translation: Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with brave men, in the assembly.

Sanskit Text: यो जात एव परथमो मनस्वान देवो देवान करतुना पर्यभूषत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo jāta eva prathamo manasvān devo devān kratunā paryabhūṣat |
Translation: 1. HE who, just born, chief God of lofty spirit by power and might became the Gods’ protector,

Sanskit Text: यस्य शुष्माद रोदसी अभ्यसेतां नर्म्णस्य मह्ना स जनास इन्द्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya śuṣmād rodasī abhyasetāṃ nṛmṇasya mahnā sa janāsa indraḥ ||
Translation: Before whose breath through greatness of his valour the two worlds trembled, He, O men, is Indra.

Sanskit Text: यः पर्थिवीं वयथमानामद्रंहद यः पर्वतान परकुपितानरम्णात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ pṛthivīṃ vyathamānāmadṛṃhad yaḥ parvatān prakupitānaramṇāt |
Translation: 2 He who fixed fast and firm the earth that staggered, and set at rest the agitated mountains,

Sanskit Text: यो अन्तरिक्षं विममे वरीयो यो दयामस्तभ्नात स जनास इन्द्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo antarikṣaṃ vimame varīyo yo dyāmastabhnāt sa janāsa indraḥ ||
Translation: Who measured out the air's wide middle region and gave the heaven support, He, men, is Indra.

Sanskit Text: यो हत्वाहिमरिणात सप्त सिन्धून यो गा उदाजदपधा वलस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo hatvāhimariṇāt sapta sindhūn yo ghā udājadapadhā valasya |
Translation: 3 Who slew the Dragon, freed the Seven Rivers, and drove the kine forth from the cave of Vala,

Sanskit Text: यो अश्मनोरन्तरग्निं जजान संव्र्क समत्सु स. ज. इ. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo aśmanorantaraghniṃ jajāna saṃvṛk samatsu s. j. i. ||
Translation: Begat the fire between two stones, the spoiler in warriors’ battle, He, O men, is Indra.

Sanskit Text: येनेमा विश्वा चयवना कर्तानि यो दासं वर्णमधरंगुहाकः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenemā viśvā cyavanā kṛtāni yo dāsaṃ varṇamadharaṃghuhākaḥ |
Translation: 4 By whom this universe was made to tremble, who chased away the humbled brood of demons,

Sanskit Text: शवघ्नीव यो जिगीवान लक्षमाददर्यः पुष्टानि स. ज. इ. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śvaghnīva yo jighīvān lakṣamādadaryaḥ puṣṭāni s. j. i. ||
Translation: Who, like a gambler gathering his winnings seized the foe's riches, He, O men, is Indra.

Sanskit Text: यं समा पर्छन्ति कुह सेति घोरमुतेमाहुर्नैषो अस्तीत्येनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ smā pṛchanti kuha seti ghoramutemāhurnaiṣo astītyenam |
Translation: 5 Of whom, the Terrible, they ask, Where is He? or verily they say of him, He is not.

Sanskit Text: सो अर्यः पुष्तीर्विज इवा मिनाति शरदस्मै धत्तस. ज. इ. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: so aryaḥ puṣtīrvija ivā mināti śradasmai dhattas. j. i. ||
Translation: He sweeps away, like birds, the foe's possessions. Have faith in him, for He, O men, is Indra.

Sanskit Text: यो रध्रस्य चोदिता यः कर्शस्य यो बरह्मणो नाधमानस्यकीरेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo radhrasya coditā yaḥ kṛśasya yo brahmaṇo nādhamānasyakīreḥ |
Translation: 6 Stirrer to action of the poor and lowly, of priest, of suppliant who sings his praises;

Sanskit Text: युक्तग्राव्णो यो.अविता सुशिप्रः सुतसोमस्य स. ज. इ. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuktaghrāvṇo yo.avitā suśipraḥ sutasomasya s. j. i. ||
Translation: Who, fair-faced, favours him who presses Soma with stones made ready, He, O men, is Indra.

Sanskit Text: यस्याश्वासः परदिशि यस्य गावो यस्य गरामा यस्य विश्वे रथासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasyāśvāsaḥ pradiśi yasya ghāvo yasya ghrāmā yasya viśve rathāsaḥ |
Translation: 7 He under whose supreme control are horses, all chariots, and the villages, and cattle;

Sanskit Text: यः सूर्यं य उषसं जजान यो अपां नेता स. ज. इ. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ sūryaṃ ya uṣasaṃ jajāna yo apāṃ netā s. j. i. ||
Translation: He who gave being to the Sun and Morning, who leads the waters, He, O men, is Indra.

Sanskit Text: यं करन्दसी संयती विह्वयेते परे.अवर उभया अमित्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ krandasī saṃyatī vihvayete pare.avara ubhayā amitrāḥ |
Translation: 8 To whom two armies cry in close encounter, both enemies, the stronger and the weaker;

Sanskit Text: समानं चिद रथमातस्थिवांसा नाना हवेते स. ज. इ. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samānaṃ cid rathamātasthivāṃsā nānā havete s. j. i. ||
Translation: Whom two invoke upon one chariot mounted, each for himself, He, O ye men, is Indra.

Sanskit Text: यस्मान न रते विजयन्ते जनासो यं युध्यमाना अवसे हवन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasmān na ṛte vijayante janāso yaṃ yudhyamānā avase havante |
Translation: 9 Without whose help our people never conquer; whom, battling, they invoke to give them succour;

Sanskit Text: यो विश्वस्य परतिमानं बभूव यो अच्युतच्युत स. ज. इ. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo viśvasya pratimānaṃ babhūva yo acyutacyut s. j. i. ||
Translation: He of whom all this world is but the copy, who shakes things moveless, He, O men, is Indra.

Sanskit Text: यः शश्वतो मह्येनो दधानानमन्यमानाञ्छर्वा जघान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ śaśvato mahyeno dadhānānamanyamānāñcharvā jaghāna |
Translation: 10 He who hath smitten, ere they knew their danger, with his hurled weapon many grievous sinners;

Sanskit Text: यः शर्धते नानुददाति शर्ध्यां यो दस्योर्हन्तास. ज. इ. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ śardhate nānudadāti śṛdhyāṃ yo dasyorhantās. j. i. ||
Translation: Who pardons not his boldness who provokes him, who slays the Dasyu, He, O men, is Indra.

Sanskit Text: यः शम्बरं पर्वतेषु कषियन्तं चत्वारिंश्यां शरद्यन्वविन्दत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ śambaraṃ parvateṣu kṣiyantaṃ catvāriṃśyāṃ śaradyanvavindat |
Translation: 11 He who discovered in the fortieth autumn Śambara as he dwelt among the mountains;

Sanskit Text: ओजायमानं यो अहिं जघान दानुं शयानंस. ज. इ. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ojāyamānaṃ yo ahiṃ jaghāna dānuṃ śayānaṃs. j. i. ||
Translation: Who slew the Dragon putting forth his vigour, the demon lying there, He, men, is Indra.

Sanskit Text: यः सप्तरश्मिर्व्र्षभस्तुविष्मानवास्र्जत सर्तवे सप्तसिन्धून |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ saptaraśmirvṛṣabhastuviṣmānavāsṛjat sartave saptasindhūn |
Translation: 12 Who with seven guiding reins, the Bull, the Mighty, set free the Seven great Floods to flow at pleasure;

Sanskit Text: यो रौहिणमस्फुरद वज्रबाहुर्द्यामारोहन्तंस. ज. इ. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo rauhiṇamasphurad vajrabāhurdyāmārohantaṃs. j. i. ||
Translation: Who, thunder-armed, rent Rauhiṇa in pieces when scaling heaven, He, O ye men, is Indra.

Sanskit Text: दयावा चिदस्मै पर्थिवी नमेते शुष्माच्चिदस्य पर्वता भयन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyāvā cidasmai pṛthivī namete śuṣmāccidasya parvatā bhayante |
Translation: 13 Even the Heaven and Earth bow down before him, before his very breath the mountains tremble.

Sanskit Text: यः सोमपा निचितो वज्रबाहुर्यो वज्रहस्तः स. ज. इ. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ somapā nicito vajrabāhuryo vajrahastaḥ s. j. i. ||
Translation: Known as the Soma-drinker, armed with thunder, who wields the bolt, He, O ye men, is Indra.

Sanskit Text: यः सुन्वन्तमवति यः पचन्तं यः शंसन्तं यः शशमानमूती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ sunvantamavati yaḥ pacantaṃ yaḥ śaṃsantaṃ yaḥ śaśamānamūtī |
Translation: 14 Who aids with favour him who pours the Soma and him who brews it, sacrificer, singer.

Sanskit Text: यस्य बरह्म वर्धनं यस्य सोमो यस्येदं राधः स. ज. इ. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya brahma vardhanaṃ yasya somo yasyedaṃ rādhaḥ s. j. i. ||
Translation: Whom prayer exalts, and pouring forth of Soma, and this our gift, He, O ye men, Is Indra.

Sanskit Text: यः सुन्वते पचते दुध्र आ चिद वाजं दर्दर्षि स किलासि सत्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ sunvate pacate dudhra ā cid vājaṃ dardarṣi sa kilāsi satyaḥ |
Translation: 15 Thou verily art fierce and true who sendest strength to the man who brews and pours libation.

Sanskit Text: वयं त इन्द्र विश्वह परियासः सुवीरासो विदथमा वदेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ ta indra viśvaha priyāsaḥ suvīrāso vidathamā vadema ||
Translation: So may we evermore, thy friends, O Indra, speak loudly to the synod with our heroes.

Sanskit Text: रतुर्जनित्री तस्या अपस परि मक्षू जात आविशद यासु वर्धते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛturjanitrī tasyā apas pari makṣū jāta āviśad yāsu vardhate |
Translation: 1. THE Season was the parent, and when born therefrom it entered rapidly the floods wherein it grows.

Sanskit Text: तदाहना अभवत पिप्युषी पयो.अंशोः पीयूषं परथमं तदुक्थ्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadāhanā abhavat pipyuṣī payo.aṃśoḥ pīyūṣaṃ prathamaṃ tadukthyam ||
Translation: Thence was it full of sap, streaming with milky juice: the milk of the plant's stalk is chief and meet for lauds.

Sanskit Text: सध्रीमा यन्ति परि बिभ्रतीः पयो विश्वप्स्न्याय पर भरन्त भोजनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadhrīmā yanti pari bibhratīḥ payo viśvapsnyāya pra bharanta bhojanam |
Translation: 2 They come trooping together bearing milk to him, and bring him sustenance who gives support to all.

Sanskit Text: समानो अध्वा परवतामनुष्यदे यस्ताक्र्णोः परथमं सास्युक्थ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samāno adhvā pravatāmanuṣyade yastākṛṇoḥ prathamaṃ sāsyukthyaḥ ||
Translation: The way is common for the downward streams to flow. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

Sanskit Text: अन्वेको वदति यद ददाति तद रूपा मिनन तदपा एक ईयते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anveko vadati yad dadāti tad rūpā minan tadapā eka īyate |
Translation: 3 One priest announces what the institutor gives: one, altering the forms, zealously plies his task,

Sanskit Text: विश्वा एकस्य विनुदस्तितिक्षते यस्ताक्र... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā ekasya vinudastitikṣate yastākṛ... ||
Translation: The third corrects the imperfections left by each. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

Sanskit Text: परजाभ्यः पुष्टिं विभजन्त आसते रयिमिव पर्ष्ठं परभवन्तमायते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prajābhyaḥ puṣṭiṃ vibhajanta āsate rayimiva pṛṣṭhaṃ prabhavantamāyate |
Translation: 4 Dealing out food unto their people there they sit, like wealth to him who comes, more than the back can bear.

Sanskit Text: असिन्वन दंष्ट्रैः पितुरत्ति भोजनं यस्ताक्र... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asinvan daṃṣṭraiḥ pituratti bhojanaṃ yastākṛ... ||
Translation: Greedily with his teeth he eats the master's food. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

Sanskit Text: अधाक्र्णोः पर्थिवीं सन्द्र्शे दिवे यो धौतीनामहिहन्नारिणक पथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhākṛṇoḥ pṛthivīṃ sandṛśe dive yo dhautīnāmahihannāriṇak pathaḥ |
Translation: 5 Thou hast created earth to look upon the sky: thou, slaying Ahi, settest free the river's paths.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा सतोमेभिरुदभिर्न वाजिनं देवं देवा अजनन सास्युक्थ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā stomebhirudabhirna vājinaṃ devaṃ devā ajanan sāsyukthyaḥ ||
Translation: Thee, such, a God, the Gods have quickened with their lauds, even as a steed with waters: meet for praise art thou.

Sanskit Text: यो भोजनं च दयसे च वर्धनमार्द्रादा शुष्कं मधुमद दुदोहिथ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo bhojanaṃ ca dayase ca vardhanamārdrādā śuṣkaṃ madhumad dudohitha |
Translation: 6 Thou givest increase, thou dealest to us our food: thou milkest from the moist the dry, the rich in sweets.

Sanskit Text: स शेवधिं नि दधिषे विवस्वति विश्वस्यैक ईशिषे सास्यु. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa śevadhiṃ ni dadhiṣe vivasvati viśvasyaika īśiṣe sāsyu. ||
Translation: Thou by the worshipper layest thy precious store: thou art sole Lord of all. Meet for our praise art thou.

Sanskit Text: यः पुष्पिणीश्च परस्वश्च धर्मणाधि दाने वयवनीरधारयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ puṣpiṇīśca prasvaśca dharmaṇādhi dāne vyavanīradhārayaḥ |
Translation: 7 Thou who hast spread abroad the streams by stablished law, and in the field the plants that blossom and bear seed;

Sanskit Text: यश्चासमा अजनो दिद्युतो दिव उरुरूर्वानभितः स. उ. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaścāsamā ajano didyuto diva ururūrvānabhitaḥ s. u. ||
Translation: Thou who hast made the matchless lightnings of the sky,—vast, compassing vast realms, meet for our praise art thou.

Sanskit Text: यो नार्मरं सहवसुं निहन्तवे पर्क्षाय च दासवेशाय चावहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo nārmaraṃ sahavasuṃ nihantave pṛkṣāya ca dāsaveśāya cāvahaḥ |
Translation: 8 Who broughtest Nārmara with all his wealth, for sake of food, to slay him that the fiends might be destroyed,

Sanskit Text: ऊर्जयन्त्या अपरिविष्टमास्यमुतैवाद्य पुरुक्र्त्स. उ. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrjayantyā apariviṣṭamāsyamutaivādya purukṛts. u. ||
Translation: Broughtest the face unclouded of the strengthening one, performing much even now, worthy art thou of praise.

Sanskit Text: शतं वा यस्य दश साकमाद्य एकस्य शरुष्टौ यद धचोदमाविथ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ vā yasya daśa sākamādya ekasya śruṣṭau yad dhacodamāvitha |
Translation: 9 Thou boundest up the Dāsa's hundred friends and ten, when, at one's hearing, thou helpest thy worshipper.

Sanskit Text: अरज्जौ दस्यून समुनब दभीतये सुप्राव्योभवः स. उ. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arajjau dasyūn samunab dabhītaye suprāvyoabhavaḥ s. u. ||
Translation: Thou for Dabhīti boundest Dasyus not with cords; Thou wast a mighty help. Worthy of lauds art thou.

Sanskit Text: विश्वेदनु रोधना अस्य पौंस्यं ददुरस्मै दधिरे कर्त्नवे धनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvedanu rodhanā asya pauṃsyaṃ dadurasmai dadhire kṛtnave dhanam |
Translation: 10 All banks of rivers yielded to his manly might; to him they gave, to him, the Strong, gave up their wealth.

Sanskit Text: षळ अस्तभ्ना विष्टिरः पञ्च सन्द्र्शः परिपरो अभवः स. उ. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṣaḷ astabhnā viṣṭiraḥ pañca sandṛśaḥ pariparo abhavaḥ s. u. ||
Translation: The six directions hast thou fixed, a five-fold view: thy victories reached afar. Worthy of lauds art thou.

Sanskit Text: सुप्रवाचनं तव वीर वीर्यं यदेकेन करतुना विन्दसे वसु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: supravācanaṃ tava vīra vīryaṃ yadekena kratunā vindase vasu |
Translation: 11 Meet for high praise, O Hero, is thy power, that with thy single wisdom thou obtainest wealth,

Sanskit Text: जातूष्ठिरस्य पर वयः सहस्वतो या चकर्थ सेन्द्र विश्वास्युक्थ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jātūṣṭhirasya pra vayaḥ sahasvato yā cakartha sendra viśvāsyukthyaḥ ||
Translation: The life-support of conquering Jātūṣṭhira. Indra, for all thy deeds, worthy of lauds art thou.

Sanskit Text: अरमयः सरपसस्तराय कं तुर्वीतये च वय्याय च सरुतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aramayaḥ sarapasastarāya kaṃ turvītaye ca vayyāya ca srutim |
Translation: 12 Thou for Turvīti heldest still the flowing floods, the river-stream for Vayya easily to pass

Sanskit Text: नीचा सन्तमुदनयः पराव्र्जं परान्धं शरोणं शरवयन स. उ. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nīcā santamudanayaḥ parāvṛjaṃ prāndhaṃ śroṇaṃ śravayan s. u. ||
Translation: Didst raise the outcast from the depths, and gavest fame unto the halt and blind. Worthy of lauds art thou.

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं तद वसो दानाय राधः समर्थयस्व बहु ते वसव्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ tad vaso dānāya rādhaḥ samarthayasva bahu te vasavyam |
Translation: 13 Prepare thyself to grant us that great bounty, O Vasu, for abundant is thy treasure.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र यच्चित्रं शरवस्या अनु दयून बर्हद वदेम व. स. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra yaccitraṃ śravasyā anu dyūn bṛhad vadema v. s. ||
Translation: Snatch up the wonderful, O Indra, daily. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

Sanskit Text: विश्वजिते धनजिते सवर्जिते सत्राजिते नर्जित उर्वराजिते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvajite dhanajite svarjite satrājite nṛjita urvarājite |
Translation: 1. To him the Lord of all, the Lord of wealth, of light; him who is Lord for ever, Lord of men and tilth,

Sanskit Text: अश्वजिते गोजिते अब्जिते भरेन्द्राय सोमं यजताय हर्यतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvajite ghojite abjite bharendrāya somaṃ yajatāya haryatam ||
Translation: Him who is Lord of horses, Lord of kine, of floods, to Indra, to the Holy bring sweet Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: अभिभुवे.अभिभङगाय वन्वते.अषाळ्हाय सहमानाय वेधसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhibhuve.abhibhaṅghāya vanvate.aṣāḷhāya sahamānāya vedhase |
Translation: 2 To him the potent One, who conquers and breaks down, the Victor never vanquished who disposes all,

Sanskit Text: तुविग्रये वह्नये दुष्टरीतवे सत्रासाहे नम इन्द्राय वोचत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tuvighraye vahnaye duṣṭarītave satrāsāhe nama indrāya vocata ||
Translation: The mighty-voiced, the rider, unassailable, to Indra everconquering speak your reverent prayer.

Sanskit Text: सत्रासाहो जनभक्षो जनंसहश्च्यवनो युध्मो अनु जोषमुक्षितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satrāsāho janabhakṣo janaṃsahaścyavano yudhmo anu joṣamukṣitaḥ |
Translation: 3 Still Victor, loved by mortals, ruler over men, o’erthrower, warrior, he hath waxen as he would;

Sanskit Text: वर्तंचयः सहुरिर्विक्ष्वारित इन्द्रस्य वोचं पर कर्तानि वीर्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛtaṃcayaḥ sahurirvikṣvārita indrasya vocaṃ pra kṛtāni vīryā ||
Translation: Host-gatherer, triumphant, honoured mid the folk. Indra's heroic deeds will I tell forth to all.

Sanskit Text: अनानुदो वर्षभो दोधतो वधो गम्भीर रष्वो असमष्टकाव्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anānudo vṛṣabho dodhato vadho ghambhīra ṛṣvo asamaṣṭakāvyaḥ |
Translation: 4 The strong who never yields, who slew the furious fiend, the deep, the vast, of wisdom unattainable;

Sanskit Text: रध्रचोदः शनथनो वीळितस पर्थुरिन्द्रः सुयज्ञ उषसः सवर्जनत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: radhracodaḥ śnathano vīḷitas pṛthurindraḥ suyajña uṣasaḥ svarjanat ||
Translation: Who speeds the good, the breaker-down, the firm, the vast,—Indra whose rites bring joy hath made the light of Dawn.

Sanskit Text: यज्णेन गातुमप्तुरो विविद्रिरे धियो हिन्वाना उशिजो मनीषिणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajṇena ghātumapturo vividrire dhiyo hinvānā uśijo manīṣiṇaḥ |
Translation: 5 By sacrifice the yearning sages sending forth their songs found furtherance from him who speeds the flood.

Sanskit Text: अभिस्वरा निषदा गा अवस्यव इन्द्रे हिन्वाना दरविणान्याशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhisvarā niṣadā ghā avasyava indre hinvānā draviṇānyāśata ||
Translation: In Indra seeking help with worship and with hymn, they drew him to themselves and won them kine and wealth.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र शरेष्ठानि दरविणानि धेहि चित्तिं दक्षस्य सुभगत्वं अस्मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra śreṣṭhāni draviṇāni dhehi cittiṃ dakṣasya subhaghatvaṃ asme |
Translation: 6 Indra, bestow on us the best of treasures, the spirit of ability and fortune;

Sanskit Text: पोषं रयीणामरिष्टिं तनूनां सवाद्मानं वाचः सुदिनत्वमह्नाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: poṣaṃ rayīṇāmariṣṭiṃ tanūnāṃ svādmānaṃ vācaḥ sudinatvamahnām ||
Translation: Increase of riches, safety of our bodies, charm of sweet speech, and days of pleasant weather.

Sanskit Text: गणानां तवा गणपतिं हवामहे कविं कवीनामुपमश्रवस्तमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghaṇānāṃ tvā ghaṇapatiṃ havāmahe kaviṃ kavīnāmupamaśravastamam |
Translation: 1. WE call thee, Lord and Leader of the heavenly hosts, the wise among the wise, the famousest of all,

Sanskit Text: जयेष्ठराजं बरह्मणां बरह्मणस पत आ नः षर्ण्वन्नूतिभिः सीद सादनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyeṣṭharājaṃ brahmaṇāṃ brahmaṇas pata ā naḥ ṣṛṇvannūtibhiḥ sīda sādanam ||
Translation: The King supreme of prayers, O Brahmaṇaspati: hear us with help; sit down in place of sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: देवाश्चित ते असुर्य परचेतसो बर्हस्पते यज्ञियं भागमानशुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāścit te asurya pracetaso bṛhaspate yajñiyaṃ bhāghamānaśuḥ |
Translation: 2 Bṛhaspati, God immortal! verily the Gods have gained from thee, the wise, a share in holy rites.

Sanskit Text: उस्रा इव सूर्यो जयोतिषा महो विश्वेषामिज्जनिता बरह्मणामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: usrā iva sūryo jyotiṣā maho viśveṣāmijjanitā brahmaṇāmasi ||
Translation: As with great light the Sun brings forth the rays of morn, so thou alone art Father of all sacred prayer.

Sanskit Text: आ विबाध्या परिरापस्तमांसि च जयोतिष्मन्तं रथं रतस्य तिष्ठसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vibādhyā parirāpastamāṃsi ca jyotiṣmantaṃ rathaṃ ṛtasya tiṣṭhasi |
Translation: 3 When thou hast chased away revilers and the gloom, thou mountest the refulgent car of sacrifice;

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पते भीमममित्रदम्भनं रक्षोहणंगोत्रभिदं सवर्विदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspate bhīmamamitradambhanaṃ rakṣohaṇaṃghotrabhidaṃ svarvidam ||
Translation: The awful car, Bṛhaspati, that quells the foe, slays demons, cleaves the stall of kine, and finds the light.

Sanskit Text: सुनीतिभिर्नयसि तरायसे जनं यस्तुभ्यं दाशान न तमंहो अश्नवत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sunītibhirnayasi trāyase janaṃ yastubhyaṃ dāśān na tamaṃho aśnavat |
Translation: 4 Thou leadest with good guidance and preservest men; distress o’ertakes not him who offers gifts to thee.

Sanskit Text: बरह्मद्विषस्तपनो मन्युमीरसि बर्हस्पते महि तत ते महित्वनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmadviṣastapano manyumīrasi bṛhaspate mahi tat te mahitvanam ||
Translation: Him who hates prayer thou punishest, Bṛhaspati, quelling his wrath: herein is thy great mightiness.

Sanskit Text: न तमंहो न दुरितं कुतश्चन नारातयस्तितिरुर्न दवयाविनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na tamaṃho na duritaṃ kutaścana nārātayastitirurna dvayāvinaḥ |
Translation: 5 No sorrow, no distress from any side, no foes, no creatures double-tongued have overcome the man,—

Sanskit Text: विश्वा इदस्माद धवरसो वि बाधसे यं सुगोपा रक्षसि बरह्मणस पते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā idasmād dhvaraso vi bādhase yaṃ sughopā rakṣasi brahmaṇas pate ||
Translation: Thou drivest all seductive fiends away from him whom, careful guard, thou keepest Brahmaṇaspati.

Sanskit Text: तवं नो गोपाः पथिक्र्द विचक्षणस्तव वरताय मतिभिर्जरामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ no ghopāḥ pathikṛd vicakṣaṇastava vratāya matibhirjarāmahe |
Translation: 6 Thou art our keeper, wise, preparer of our paths: we, for thy service, sing to thee with hymns of praise.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पते यो नो अभि हवरो दधे सवा तं मर्मर्तु दुछुना हरस्वती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspate yo no abhi hvaro dadhe svā taṃ marmartu duchunā harasvatī ||
Translation: Bṛhaspati, whoever lays a snare for us, him may his evil fate, precipitate, destroy.

Sanskit Text: उत वा यो नो मर्चयादनागसो.अरातीवा मर्तः सानुको वर्कः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta vā yo no marcayādanāghaso.arātīvā martaḥ sānuko vṛkaḥ |
Translation: 7 Him, too, who threatens us without offence of ours, the evilminded, arrogant, rapacious man,—

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पते अप तं वर्तया पथः सुगं नो अस्यै देववीतये कर्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspate apa taṃ vartayā pathaḥ sughaṃ no asyai devavītaye kṛdhi ||
Translation: Him turn thou from our path away, Bṛhaspati: give us fair access to this banquet of the Gods.

Sanskit Text: तरातारं तवा तनूनां हवामहे.अवस्पर्तरधिवक्तारमस्मयुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trātāraṃ tvā tanūnāṃ havāmahe.avaspartaradhivaktāramasmayum |
Translation: 8 Thee as protector of our bodies we invoke, thee, saviour, as the comforter who loveth us.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पते देवनिदो नि बर्हय मा दुरेवा उत्तरं सुम्नमुन नशन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspate devanido ni barhaya mā durevā uttaraṃ sumnamun naśan ||
Translation: Strike, O Bṛhaspati, the Gods’ revilers down, and let not the unrighteous come to highest bliss.

Sanskit Text: तवया वयं सुव्र्धा बरह्मणस पते सपार्हा वसु मनुष्या ददीमहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā vayaṃ suvṛdhā brahmaṇas pate spārhā vasu manuṣyā dadīmahi |
Translation: 9 Through thee, kind prosperer, O Brahmaṇaspati, may we obtain the wealth of Men which all desire:

Sanskit Text: या नो दूरे तळितो या अरातयो.अभि सन्ति जम्भया ता अनप्नसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā no dūre taḷito yā arātayo.abhi santi jambhayā tā anapnasaḥ ||
Translation: And all our enemies, who near or far away prevail against us, crush, and leave them destitute.

Sanskit Text: तवया वयमुत्तमं धीमहे वयो बर्हस्पते पप्रिणा सस्निना युजा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā vayamuttamaṃ dhīmahe vayo bṛhaspate papriṇā sasninā yujā |
Translation: 10 With thee as our own rich and liberal ally may we, Bṛhaspati, gain highest power of life.

Sanskit Text: मा नो दुःशंसो अभिदिप्सुरीशत पर सुशंसा मतिभिस्तारिषीमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no duḥśaṃso abhidipsurīśata pra suśaṃsā matibhistāriṣīmahi ||
Translation: Let not the guileful wicked man be lord of us:—still may we prosper, singing goodly hymns of praise.

Sanskit Text: अनानुदो वर्षभो जग्मिराहवं निष्टप्ता शत्रुं पर्तनासुसासहिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anānudo vṛṣabho jaghmirāhavaṃ niṣṭaptā śatruṃ pṛtanāsusāsahiḥ |
Translation: 11 Strong, never yielding, hastening to the battle-cry, consumer of the foe, victorious in the strife,

Sanskit Text: असि सत्य रणया बरह्मणस पत उग्रस्य चिद दमिता वीळुहर्षिणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asi satya ṛṇayā brahmaṇas pata ughrasya cid damitā vīḷuharṣiṇaḥ ||
Translation: Thou art sin's true avenger, Brahmaṇaspati, who tamest e’en the fierce, the wildly passionate.

Sanskit Text: अदेवेन मनसा यो रिशण्यति शासामुग्रो मन्यमानो जिघांसति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adevena manasā yo riśaṇyati śāsāmughro manyamāno jighāṃsati |
Translation: 12 Whoso with mind ungodly seeks to do us harm, who, deeming him a man of might mid lords, would slay,—

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पते म परणक तस्य नो वधो नि कर्म मन्युं दुरेवस्य शर्धतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspate ma praṇak tasya no vadho ni karma manyuṃ durevasya śardhataḥ ||
Translation: Let not his deadly blow reach us, Bṛhaspati; may we humiliate the strong ill-doer's wrath.

Sanskit Text: भरेषु हव्यो नमसोपसद्यो गन्ता वाजेषु सनिता धनं धनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhareṣu havyo namasopasadyo ghantā vājeṣu sanitā dhanaṃ dhanam |
Translation: 13 The mover mid the spoil, the winner of all wealth, to be invoked in fight and reverently adored,

Sanskit Text: विश्वा इदर्यो अभिदिप्स्वो मर्धो बर्हस्पतिर्वि ववर्हा रथां इव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā idaryo abhidipsvo mṛdho bṛhaspatirvi vavarhā rathāṃ iva ||
Translation: Bṛhaspati hath overthrown like cars of war all wicked enemies who fain would injure us.

Sanskit Text: तेजिष्थया तपनि रक्षसस्तप ये तवा निदे दधिरे दर्ष्टवीर्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tejiṣthayā tapani rakṣasastapa ye tvā nide dadhire dṛṣṭavīryam |
Translation: 14 Burn up the demons with thy fiercest flaming brand, those who have scorned thee in thy manifested might.

Sanskit Text: आविस्तत कर्ष्व यदसत त उक्थ्यं बर्हस्पते वि परिरापो अर्दय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvistat kṛṣva yadasat ta ukthyaṃ bṛhaspate vi parirāpo ardaya ||
Translation: Show forth that power that shall deserve the hymn of praise: destroy the evil speakers, O Bṛhaspati.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पते अति यदर्यो अर्हाद दयुमद विभाति करतुमज्जनेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspate ati yadaryo arhād dyumad vibhāti kratumajjaneṣu |
Translation: 15 Bṛhaspati, that which the foe deserves not which shines among the folk effectual, splendid,

Sanskit Text: यद दीदयच्छवस रतप्रजात तदस्मसु दरविणं धेहिचित्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad dīdayacchavasa ṛtaprajāta tadasmasu draviṇaṃ dhehicitram ||
Translation: That, Son of Law I which is with might refulgent-that treasure wonderful bestow thou on us.

Sanskit Text: मा न सतेनेभ्यो ये अभि दरुहस पदे निरामिणो रिपवो.अन्नेषु जाग्र्धुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā na stenebhyo ye abhi druhas pade nirāmiṇo ripavo.anneṣu jāghṛdhuḥ |
Translation: 16 Give us not up to those who, foes in ambuscade, are greedy for the wealth of him who sits at ease,

Sanskit Text: आ देवानामोहते वि वरयो हर्दि बर्हस्पते नपरः साम्नो विदुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā devānāmohate vi vrayo hṛdi bṛhaspate naparaḥ sāmno viduḥ ||
Translation: Who cherish in their heart abandonment of Gods. Bṛhaspati, no further rest shall they obtain.

Sanskit Text: विश्वेभ्यो हि तवा भुवनेभ्यस परि तवष्टाजनत साम्नः साम्नः कविः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvebhyo hi tvā bhuvanebhyas pari tvaṣṭājanat sāmnaḥ sāmnaḥ kaviḥ |
Translation: 17 For Tvaṣṭar, he who knows each sacred song, brought thee to life, preeminent o’er all the things that be.

Sanskit Text: स रणचिद रणया बरह्मणस पतिर्द्रुहो हन्ता मह रतस्य धर्तरि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ṛṇacid ṛṇayā brahmaṇas patirdruho hantā maha ṛtasya dhartari ||
Translation: Guilt-scourger, guilt-avenger is Bṛhaspati, who slays the spoiler and upholds the mighty Law.

Sanskit Text: तव शरिये वयजिहीत पर्वतो गवां गोत्रमुदस्र्जो यदङगिरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava śriye vyajihīta parvato ghavāṃ ghotramudasṛjo yadaṅghiraḥ |
Translation: 18 The mountain, for thy glory, cleft itself apart when, Aṅgiras! thou openedst the stall of kine.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रेण युजा तमसा परीव्र्तं बर्हस्पते निरपामौब्जो अर्णवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indreṇa yujā tamasā parīvṛtaṃ bṛhaspate nirapāmaubjo arṇavam ||
Translation: Thou, O Bṛhaspati, with Indra for ally didst hurl down water-floods which gloom had compassed round.

Sanskit Text: बरह्मणस पते तवमस्य यन्ता सूक्तस्य बोधि तनयं च जिन्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmaṇas pate tvamasya yantā sūktasya bodhi tanayaṃ ca jinva |
Translation: 19 O Brahmaṇaspati, be thou controller of this our hymn and prosper thou our children.

Sanskit Text: विश्वं तद भद्रं यदवन्ति देवा बर्हद वदेम ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvaṃ tad bhadraṃ yadavanti devā bṛhad vadema ... ||
Translation: All that the Gods regard with love is blessed. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

Sanskit Text: इन्धानो अग्निं वनवद वनुष्यतः कर्तब्रह्मा शूशुवद रातहव्य इत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indhāno aghniṃ vanavad vanuṣyataḥ kṛtabrahmā śūśuvad rātahavya it ||
Translation: 1. HE lighting up the flame shall conquer enemies: strong shall he be who offers prayer and brings his gift.

Sanskit Text: जातेन जातमति स पर सर्स्र्ते यं-यं युजंक्र्णुते बरह्मणस पतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jātena jātamati sa pra sarsṛte yaṃ-yaṃ yujaṃkṛṇute brahmaṇas patiḥ ||
Translation: He with his seed spreads forth beyond another's seed, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

Sanskit Text: वीरेभिर्वीरान वनवद वनुष्यतो गोभी रयिं पप्रथद बोधति तमना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vīrebhirvīrān vanavad vanuṣyato ghobhī rayiṃ paprathad bodhati tmanā |
Translation: 2 With heroes he shall overcome his hero foes, and spread his wealth by kine wise by himself is be.

Sanskit Text: तोकं च तस्य तनयं च वर्धते यं-यं ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tokaṃ ca tasya tanayaṃ ca vardhate yaṃ-yaṃ ... ||
Translation: His children and his children's children grow in strength, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

Sanskit Text: सिन्धुर्न कषोदः शिमीवान रघायतो वर्षेव वध्रीन्रभि वष्ट्योजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sindhurna kṣodaḥ śimīvān ṛghāyato vṛṣeva vadhrīnrabhi vaṣṭyojasā |
Translation: 3 He, mighty like a raving river's billowy flood, as a bull conquers oxen, overcomes with strength.

Sanskit Text: अग्नेरिव परसितिर्नाह वर्तवे यं-यं .. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghneriva prasitirnāha vartave yaṃ-yaṃ .. ||
Translation: Like Agni's blazing rush he may not be restrained, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

Sanskit Text: तस्मा अर्षन्ति दिव्या असश्चतः स सत्वभिः परथमो गोषुगछति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmā arṣanti divyā asaścataḥ sa satvabhiḥ prathamo ghoṣughachati |
Translation: 4 For him the floods of heaven flow never failing down: first with the heroes he goes forth to war for kine.

Sanskit Text: अनिभ्र्ष्टतविषिर्हन्त्योजसा यं-यं ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anibhṛṣṭataviṣirhantyojasā yaṃ-yaṃ ... ||
Translation: He slays in unabated vigour with great might, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

Sanskit Text: तस्मा इद विश्वे धुनयन्त सिन्धवो.अछिद्रा शर्म दधिरे पुरूणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmā id viśve dhunayanta sindhavo.achidrā śarma dadhire purūṇi |
Translation: 5 All roaring rivers pour their waters down for him, and many a flawless shelter hath been granted him.

Sanskit Text: देवानां सुम्ने सुभगः स एधते यं-यं ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānāṃ sumne subhaghaḥ sa edhate yaṃ-yaṃ ... ||
Translation: Blest with the happiness of Gods he prospers well, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

Sanskit Text: रजुरिच्छंसो वनवद वनुष्यतो देवयन्निददेवयन्तमभ्यसत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛjuricchaṃso vanavad vanuṣyato devayannidadevayantamabhyasat |
Translation: 1. THE righteous singer shall o’ercome his enemies, and he who serves the Gods subdue the godless man.

Sanskit Text: सुप्रावीरिद वनवत पर्त्सु दुष्टरं यज्वेदयज्योर्वि भजाति भोजनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suprāvīrid vanavat pṛtsu duṣṭaraṃ yajvedayajyorvi bhajāti bhojanam ||
Translation: The zealous man shall vanquish the invincible, the worshipper share the food of him who worships not.

Sanskit Text: यजस्व वीर पर विहि मनायतो भद्रं मनः कर्णुष्व वर्त्रतूर्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajasva vīra pra vihi manāyato bhadraṃ manaḥ kṛṇuṣva vṛtratūrye |
Translation: 2 Worship, thou hero, chase the arrogant afar: put on auspicious courage for the fight with foes.

Sanskit Text: हविष कर्णुष्व सुभगो यथाससि बरह्मणस पतेरव आ वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: haviṣ kṛṇuṣva subhagho yathāsasi brahmaṇas paterava ā vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: Prepare oblation so that thou mayst have success. we crave the favouring help of Brahmaṇaspati.

Sanskit Text: स इज्जनेन स विशा स जन्मना स पुत्रैर्वाजं भरतेधना नर्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ijjanena sa viśā sa janmanā sa putrairvājaṃ bharatedhanā nṛbhiḥ |
Translation: 3 He with his folk, his house, his family, his sons, gains booty for himself, and, with the heroes, wealth,

Sanskit Text: देवानां यः पितरमाविवासति शरद्धामना हविषा बरह्मणस पतिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānāṃ yaḥ pitaramāvivāsati śraddhāmanā haviṣā brahmaṇas patim ||
Translation: Who with oblation and a true believing heart serves Brahmaṇaspati the Father of the Gods.

Sanskit Text: यो अस्मै हव्यैर्घ्र्तवद्भिरविधत पर तं पराचा नयति बरह्मणस पतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo asmai havyairghṛtavadbhiravidhat pra taṃ prācā nayati brahmaṇas patiḥ |
Translation: 4 Whoso hath honoured him with offerings rich in oil, him Brahmaṇaspati leads forward on his way,

Sanskit Text: उरुष्यतीमंहसो रक्षती रिषो.अंहोश्चिदस्मा उरुचक्रिरद्भुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uruṣyatīmaṃhaso rakṣatī riṣo.aṃhościdasmā urucakriradbhutaḥ ||
Translation: Saves him from sorrow, frees him from his enemy, and is his wonderful deliverer from woe.

Sanskit Text: इमा गिर आदित्येभ्यो घर्तस्नूः सनाद राजभ्यो जुह्वा जुहोमि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā ghira ādityebhyo ghṛtasnūḥ sanād rājabhyo juhvā juhomi |
Translation: 1. THESE hymns that drop down fatness, with the ladle I ever offer to the Kings Ādityas.

Sanskit Text: शर्णोतु मित्रो अर्यमा भगो नस्तुविजातो वरुणो दक्षो अंशः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇotu mitro aryamā bhagho nastuvijāto varuṇo dakṣo aṃśaḥ ||
Translation: May Mitra, Aryaman, and Bhaga hear us, the mighty Varuṇa Dakṣa, and Aṁśa.

Sanskit Text: इमं सतोमं सक्रतवो मे अद्य मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणो जुषन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ stomaṃ sakratavo me adya mitro aryamā varuṇo juṣanta |
Translation: 2 With one accord may Aryaman and Mitra and Varuṇa this day accept this praise-song—

Sanskit Text: आदित्यासः शुचयो धारपूता अव्र्जिना अनवद्या अरिष्टाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityāsaḥ śucayo dhārapūtā avṛjinā anavadyā ariṣṭāḥ ||
Translation: Ādityas bright and pure as streams of water, free from all guile and falsehood, blameless, perfect.

Sanskit Text: त आदित्यास उरवो गभीरा अदब्धासो दिप्सन्तो भूर्यक्षाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta ādityāsa uravo ghabhīrā adabdhāso dipsanto bhūryakṣāḥ |
Translation: 3 These Gods, Ādityas, vast, profound, and faithful, with many eyes, fain to deceive the wicked,

Sanskit Text: अन्तः पश्यन्ति वर्जिनोत साधु सर्वं राजभ्यः परमा चिदन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: antaḥ paśyanti vṛjinota sādhu sarvaṃ rājabhyaḥ paramā cidanti ||
Translation: Looking within behold the good and evil near to the Kings is even the thing most distant.

Sanskit Text: धारयन्त आदित्यासो जगत सथा देवा विश्वस्य भुवनस्य गोपाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhārayanta ādityāso jaghat sthā devā viśvasya bhuvanasya ghopāḥ |
Translation: 4 Upholding that which moves and that which moves not, Ādityas, Gods, protectors of all being,

Sanskit Text: दीर्घाधियो रक्षमाणा असुर्यं रतावानश्चयमाना रणानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dīrghādhiyo rakṣamāṇā asuryaṃ ṛtāvānaścayamānā ṛṇāni ||
Translation: Provident, guarding well the world of spirits, true to eternal Law, the debt-exactors.

Sanskit Text: विद्यामादित्या अवसो वो अस्य यदर्यमन भय आ चिन मयोभु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidyāmādityā avaso vo asya yadaryaman bhaya ā cin mayobhu |
Translation: 5 May I, Ādityas, share m this your favour which, Aryaman, brings profit e’en in danger.

Sanskit Text: युष्माकं मित्रावरुणा परणीतौ परि शवभ्रेव दुरितानिव्र्ज्याम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmākaṃ mitrāvaruṇā praṇītau pari śvabhreva duritānivṛjyām ||
Translation: Under your guidance, Varuṇa and Mitra, round troubles may I pass, like rugged places.

Sanskit Text: सुगो हि वो अर्यमन मित्र पन्था अन्र्क्षरो वरुण साधुरस्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sugho hi vo aryaman mitra panthā anṛkṣaro varuṇa sādhurasti |
Translation: 6 Smooth is your path, O Aryaman and Mitra; excellent is it, Varuṇa, and thornless.

Sanskit Text: तेनादित्या अधि वोचता नो यछता नो दुष्परिहन्तु शर्म ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tenādityā adhi vocatā no yachatā no duṣparihantu śarma ||
Translation: Thereon, Ādityas, send us down your blessing: grant us a shelter hard to be demolished.

Sanskit Text: पिपर्तु नो अदिती राजपुत्राति दवेषांस्यर्यमा सुगेभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pipartu no aditī rājaputrāti dveṣāṃsyaryamā sughebhiḥ |
Translation: 7 Mother of Kings, may Aditi transport us, by fair paths Aryaman, beyond all hatred.

Sanskit Text: बर्हन मित्रस्य वरुणस्य शर्मोप सयाम पुरुवीरा अरिष्टाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhan mitrasya varuṇasya śarmopa syāma puruvīrā ariṣṭāḥ ||
Translation: May we uninjured, girt by many heroes, win Varuṇa's and Mitra's high protection.

Sanskit Text: तिस्रो भूमीर्धारयन तरीन्रुत दयून तरीणि वरता विदथे अन्तरेषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisro bhūmīrdhārayan trīnruta dyūn trīṇi vratā vidathe antareṣām |
Translation: 8 With their support they stay three earths, three heavens; three are their functions in the Gods’ assembly.

Sanskit Text: रतेनादित्या महि वो महित्वं तदर्यमन वरुण मित्र चारु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtenādityā mahi vo mahitvaṃ tadaryaman varuṇa mitra cāru ||
Translation: Mighty through Law, Ādityas, is your greatness; fair is it, Aryaman, Varuṇa, and Mitra.

Sanskit Text: तरी रोचना दिव्या धारयन्त हिरण्ययाः शुचयो धारपूताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trī rocanā divyā dhārayanta hiraṇyayāḥ śucayo dhārapūtāḥ |
Translation: 9 Golden and splendid, pure like streams of water, they hold aloft the three bright heavenly regions.

Sanskit Text: अस्वप्नजो अनिमिषा अदब्धा उरुशंसा रजवे मर्त्याय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asvapnajo animiṣā adabdhā uruśaṃsā ṛjave martyāya ||
Translation: Ne’er do they slumber, never close their eyelids, faithful, far-ruling for the righteous mortal.

Sanskit Text: तवं विश्वेषां वरुणासि राजा ये च देवा असुर ये च मर्ताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ viśveṣāṃ varuṇāsi rājā ye ca devā asura ye ca martāḥ |
Translation: 10 Thou over all, O Varuṇa, art Sovran, be they Gods, Asura! or be they mortals.

Sanskit Text: शतं नो रास्व शरदो विचक्षे.अच्यामायूंषि सुधितानि पूर्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ no rāsva śarado vicakṣe.acyāmāyūṃṣi sudhitāni pūrvā ||
Translation: Grant unto us to see a hundred autumns ours be the blest long lives of our forefathers.

Sanskit Text: न दक्षिणा वि चिकिते न सव्या न पराचीनमादित्या नोतपश्चा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na dakṣiṇā vi cikite na savyā na prācīnamādityā notapaścā |
Translation: 11 Neither the right nor left do I distinguish, neither the cast nor yet the west, Ādityas.

Sanskit Text: पाक्या चिद वसवो धीर्या चिद युष्मानीतो अभयंज्योतिरश्याम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pākyā cid vasavo dhīryā cid yuṣmānīto abhayaṃjyotiraśyām ||
Translation: Simple and guided by your wisdom, Vasus! may I attain the light that brings no danger.

Sanskit Text: यो राजभ्य रतनिभ्यो ददाश यं वर्धयन्ति पुष्टयश्चनित्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo rājabhya ṛtanibhyo dadāśa yaṃ vardhayanti puṣṭayaścanityāḥ |
Translation: 12 He who bears gifts unto the Kings, true Leaders, he whom their everlasting blessings prosper,

Sanskit Text: स रेवान याति परथमो रथेन वसुदावा विदथेषु परशस्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa revān yāti prathamo rathena vasudāvā vidatheṣu praśastaḥ ||
Translation: Moves with his chariot first in rank and wealthy, munificent and lauded in assemblies.

Sanskit Text: शुचिरपः सूयवसा अदब्ध उप कषेति वर्द्धवयाः सुवीरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śucirapaḥ sūyavasā adabdha upa kṣeti vṛddhavayāḥ suvīraḥ |
Translation: 13 Pure, faithful, very strong, with heroes round him, he dwells beside the waters rich with pasture.

Sanskit Text: नकिष टं घनन्त्यन्तितो न दूराद य आदित्यानां भवति परणीतौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nakiṣ ṭaṃ ghnantyantito na dūrād ya ādityānāṃ bhavati praṇītau ||
Translation: None slays, from near at hand or from a distance, him who is under the Ādityas’ guidance.

Sanskit Text: अदिते मित्र वरुणोत मर्ळ यद वो वयं चक्र्मा कच्चिदागः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adite mitra varuṇota mṛḷa yad vo vayaṃ cakṛmā kaccidāghaḥ |
Translation: 14 Aditi, Mitra, Varuṇa, forgive us however we have erred and sinned against you.

Sanskit Text: उर्वश्यामभयं जयोतिरिन्द्र मा नो दीर्घा अभि नशन तमिस्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: urvaśyāmabhayaṃ jyotirindra mā no dīrghā abhi naśan tamisrāḥ ||
Translation: May I obtain the broad light free from peril: O Indra, let not during darkness seize us.

Sanskit Text: उभे अस्मै पीपयतः समीची दिवो वर्ष्टिं सुभगो नाम पुष्यन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhe asmai pīpayataḥ samīcī divo vṛṣṭiṃ subhagho nāma puṣyan |
Translation: 15 For him the Twain united pour their fulness, the rain from heaven: he thrives most highly favoured.

Sanskit Text: उभा कषयावाजयन याति पर्त्सूभावर्धौ भवतः साधू अस्मै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhā kṣayāvājayan yāti pṛtsūbhāvardhau bhavataḥ sādhū asmai ||
Translation: He goes to war mastering both the mansions: to him both portions of the world are gracious.

Sanskit Text: या वो माया अभिद्रुहे यजत्राः पाशा आदित्या रिपवे विच्र्त्ताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā vo māyā abhidruhe yajatrāḥ pāśā ādityā ripave vicṛttāḥ |
Translation: 16 Your guiles, ye Holy Ones, to quell oppressors, your snares spread out against the foe, Ādityas,

Sanskit Text: अश्वीव तानति येषं रथेनारिष्टा उरावा शर्मन सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvīva tānati yeṣaṃ rathenāriṣṭā urāvā śarman syāma ||
Translation: May I car-borne pass like a skilful horseman: uninjured may we dwell in spacious shelter.

Sanskit Text: माहं मघोनो वरुण परियस्य भूरिदाव्न आ विदं शूनमापेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: māhaṃ maghono varuṇa priyasya bhūridāvna ā vidaṃ śūnamāpeḥ |
Translation: 17 May I not live, O Varuṇa, to witness my wealthy, liberal, dear friend's destitution.

Sanskit Text: मा रायो राजन सुयमादव सथां बर्हद वदेम ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā rāyo rājan suyamādava sthāṃ bṛhad vadema ... ||
Translation: King, may O never lack well-ordered riches. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

Sanskit Text: रतं देवाय कर्ण्वते सवित्र इन्द्रायाहिघ्ने न रमन्त आपः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtaṃ devāya kṛṇvate savitra indrāyāhighne na ramanta āpaḥ |
Translation: 1. THE streams unceasing flow to Indra, slayer of Ahi, Savitar, God, Law's fulfiller,

Sanskit Text: अहर-अहर्यात्यक्तुरपां कियात्या परथमः सर्ग आसाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahar-aharyātyakturapāṃ kiyātyā prathamaḥ sargha āsām ||
Translation: Day after day goes on the sheen of waters. What time hath past since they were first set flowing?

Sanskit Text: यो वर्त्राय सिनमत्राभरिष्यत पर तं जनित्री विदुष उवाच |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vṛtrāya sinamatrābhariṣyat pra taṃ janitrī viduṣa uvāca |
Translation: 2 His Mother—for she knew—spake and proclaimed him who was about to cast his bolt at Vṛtra.

Sanskit Text: पथो रदन्तीरनु जोषमस्मै दिवे-दिवे धुनयो यन्त्यर्थम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: patho radantīranu joṣamasmai dive-dive dhunayo yantyartham ||
Translation: Cutting their paths according to his pleasure day after day flow to their goal the rivers.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वो हयस्थादध्यन्तरिक्षे.अधा वर्त्राय पर वधंजभार |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvo hyasthādadhyantarikṣe.adhā vṛtrāya pra vadhaṃjabhāra |
Translation: 3 Aloft he stood above the airy region, and against Vṛtra shot his deadly missile.

Sanskit Text: मिहं वसान उप हीमदुद्रोत तिग्मायुधो अजयच्छत्रुमिन्द्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mihaṃ vasāna upa hīmadudrot tighmāyudho ajayacchatrumindraḥ ||
Translation: Enveloped in a cloud he rushed upon him. Indra subdued the foe with sharpened weapons.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पते तपुषाश्नेव विध्य वर्कद्वरसो असुरस्य वीरान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspate tapuṣāśneva vidhya vṛkadvaraso asurasya vīrān |
Translation: 4 As with a bolt, Bṛhaspati, fiercely flaming, pierce thou Vṛkadvaras’, the Asura's, heroes.

Sanskit Text: यथा जघन्थ धर्षता पुरा चिदेवा जहि शत्रुमस्माकमिन्द्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā jaghantha dhṛṣatā purā cidevā jahi śatrumasmākamindra ||
Translation: Even as in time of old with might thou slewest, so slay even now our enemy, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: अव कषिप दिवो अश्मानमुच्चा येन शत्रुं मन्दसानो निजूर्वाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava kṣipa divo aśmānamuccā yena śatruṃ mandasāno nijūrvāḥ |
Translation: 5 Cast down from heaven on high thy bolt of thunder wherewith in joy thou smitest dead the foeman.

Sanskit Text: तोकस्य सातौ तनयस्य भूरेरस्मानर्धं कर्णुतादिन्द्र गोनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tokasya sātau tanayasya bhūrerasmānardhaṃ kṛṇutādindra ghonām ||
Translation: For gain of children make us thine, O Indra, of many children's children and of cattle.

Sanskit Text: पर हि करतुं वर्हथो यं वनुथो रध्रस्य सथो यजमानस्य चोदौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra hi kratuṃ vṛhatho yaṃ vanutho radhrasya stho yajamānasya codau |
Translation: 6 Whomso ye love, his power ye aid and strengthen; ye Twain are the rich worshipper's advancers.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रासोमा युवमस्मानविष्टमस्मिन भयस्थे कर्णुतमु लोकम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāsomā yuvamasmānaviṣṭamasmin bhayasthe kṛṇutamu lokam ||
Translation: Graciously favour us, Indra and Soma; give us firm standing in this time of danger.

Sanskit Text: न मा तमन न शरमन नोत तन्द्रन न वोचाम मा सुनोतेति सोमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na mā taman na śraman nota tandran na vocāma mā sunoteti somam |
Translation: 7 Let it not vex me, tire me, make me slothful, and never let us say, Press not the Soma;

Sanskit Text: यो मे पर्णाद यो ददद यो निबोधाद यो मा सुन्वन्तमुप गोभिरायत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo me pṛṇād yo dadad yo nibodhād yo mā sunvantamupa ghobhirāyat ||
Translation: For him who cares for me, gives gifts, supports me, who comes with kine to me who pour libations.

Sanskit Text: सरस्वति तवमस्मानविड्ढि मरुत्वती धर्षती जेषि शत्रून |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarasvati tvamasmānaviḍḍhi marutvatī dhṛṣatī jeṣi śatrūn |
Translation: 8 Sarasvatī, protect us: with the Maruts allied thou boldly conquerest our foemen,

Sanskit Text: तयं चिच्छर्धन्तं तविषीयमाणमिन्द्रो हन्ति वर्षभं शण्डिकानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tyaṃ cicchardhantaṃ taviṣīyamāṇamindro hanti vṛṣabhaṃ śaṇḍikānām ||
Translation: While Indra does to death the daring chieftain of Śaṇḍikas exulting in his prowess.

Sanskit Text: यो नः सनुत्य उत वा जिघत्नुरभिख्याय तं तिगितेन विध्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo naḥ sanutya uta vā jighatnurabhikhyāya taṃ tighitena vidhya |
Translation: 9 Him who waylays, yea, him who would destroy us,—aim at him, pierce him with thy sharpened weapon.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पत आयुधैर्जेषि शत्रून दरुहे रीषन्तं परि धेहि राजन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspata āyudhairjeṣi śatrūn druhe rīṣantaṃ pari dhehi rājan ||
Translation: Bṛhaspati, with arms thou slayest foemen O King, give up the spoiler to destruction.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकेभिः सत्वभिः शूर शूरैर्वीर्य कर्धि यानि ते कर्त्वानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākebhiḥ satvabhiḥ śūra śūrairvīrya kṛdhi yāni te kartvāni |
Translation: 10 Perform, O Hero, with our valiant heroes the deeds heroic which thou hast to finish.

Sanskit Text: जयोगभूवन्ननुधूपितासो हत्वी तेशामा भरानो वसूनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyoghabhūvannanudhūpitāso hatvī teśāmā bharāno vasūni ||
Translation: Long have they been inflated with presumption: slay them, and bring us hither their possessions.

Sanskit Text: तं वः शर्धं मारुतं सुम्नयुर्गिरोप बरुवे नमसा दैव्यं जनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vaḥ śardhaṃ mārutaṃ sumnayurghiropa bruve namasā daivyaṃ janam |
Translation: 11 I craving joy address with hymn and homage your heavenly host, the company of Maruts,

Sanskit Text: यथा रयिं सर्ववीरं नशामहा अपत्यसाचं शरुत्यं दिवे-दिवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā rayiṃ sarvavīraṃ naśāmahā apatyasācaṃ śrutyaṃ dive-dive ||
Translation: That we may gain wealth with full store of heroes, each day more famous, and with troops of children.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकं मित्रावरुणावतं रथमादित्यै रुद्रैर्वसुभिः सचाभुवा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākaṃ mitrāvaruṇāvataṃ rathamādityai rudrairvasubhiḥ sacābhuvā |
Translation: 1. HELP, Varuṇa and Mitra, O ye Twain allied with Vasus, Rudras, and Ādityas, help our car,

Sanskit Text: पर यद वयो न पप्तन वस्मनस परि शरवस्यवोह्र्षीवन्तो वनर्षदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yad vayo na paptan vasmanas pari śravasyavohṛṣīvanto vanarṣadaḥ ||
Translation: That, as the wild birds of the forest from their home, our horses may fly forth, glad, eager for renown.

Sanskit Text: अध समा न उदवता सजोषसो रथं देवासो अभि विक्षु वाजयुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha smā na udavatā sajoṣaso rathaṃ devāso abhi vikṣu vājayum |
Translation: 2 Yea, now ye Gods of one accord speed on our car what time among the folk it seeks an act of might;

Sanskit Text: यदाशवः पद्याभिस्तित्रतो रजः पर्थिव्याः सानौ जङघनन्त पाणिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadāśavaḥ padyābhistitrato rajaḥ pṛthivyāḥ sānau jaṅghananta pāṇibhiḥ ||
Translation: When, hasting through the region with the stamp of hoofs, our swift steeds trample on the ridges of the earth.

Sanskit Text: उत सय न इन्द्रो विश्वचर्षणिर्दिवः शर्धेन मारुतेन सुक्रतुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta sya na indro viśvacarṣaṇirdivaḥ śardhena mārutena sukratuḥ |
Translation: 3 Or may our Indra here, the Friend of all mankind, coming from heaven, most wise, girt by the Marut host,

Sanskit Text: अनु नु सथात्यव्र्काभिरूतिभी रथं महे सनये वाजसातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu nu sthātyavṛkābhirūtibhī rathaṃ mahe sanaye vājasātaye ||
Translation: Accompany, with aid untroubled by a foe, our car to mighty gain, to win the meed of strength.

Sanskit Text: उत सय देवो भुवनस्य सक्षणिस्त्वष्टा गनाभिः सजोषा जूजुवद रथम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta sya devo bhuvanasya sakṣaṇistvaṣṭā ghnābhiḥ sajoṣā jūjuvad ratham |
Translation: 4 Or may this Tvaṣṭar, God who rules the world with power, one-minded with the Goddesses speed forth our car;

Sanskit Text: इळा भगो बर्हद्दिवोत रोदसी पूषा पुरन्धिरश्विनावधा पती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iḷā bhagho bṛhaddivota rodasī pūṣā purandhiraśvināvadhā patī ||
Translation: Iḷā and Bhaga the celestial, Earth and Heaven, Pūṣan, Purandhi, and the Aśvins, ruling Lords.

Sanskit Text: उत तये देवी सुभगे मिथूद्र्शोषासानक्ता जगतामपीजुवा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tye devī subhaghe mithūdṛśoṣāsānaktā jaghatāmapījuvā |
Translation: 5 Or, seen alternate, those two blessed Goddesses, Morning and Night who stir all living things to act:

Sanskit Text: सतुषे यद वां पर्थिवि नव्यसा वच सथातुश्च वयस्त्रिवया उपस्तिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stuṣe yad vāṃ pṛthivi navyasā vaca sthātuśca vayastrivayā upastire ||
Translation: While with my newest song I praise you both, O Earth, that from what moves not ye may spread forth threefold food.

Sanskit Text: उत वः शंसमुशिजामिव शमस्यहिर्बुध्न्यो.अज एकपादुत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta vaḥ śaṃsamuśijāmiva śmasyahirbudhnyo.aja ekapāduta |
Translation: 6 Your blessing as a boon for suppliants we desire: the Dragon of the Deep, and Aja-Ekapād,

Sanskit Text: तरित रभुक्षाः सविता चनो दधे.अपां नपादाशुहेमा धिया शमि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trita ṛbhukṣāḥ savitā cano dadhe.apāṃ napādāśuhemā dhiyā śami ||
Translation: Trita, Ṛbhukṣan, Savitar shall joy in us, and the Floods’ swift Child in our worship and our prayer.

Sanskit Text: एता वो वश्म्युद्यता यजत्रा अतक्षन्नायवो नव्यसे सम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etā vo vaśmyudyatā yajatrā atakṣannāyavo navyase sam |
Translation: 7 These earnest prayers I pray to you, ye Holy: to pay you honour, living men have formed them,

Sanskit Text: शरवस्यवो वाजं चकानाः सप्तिर्न रथ्यो अह धीतिमश्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śravasyavo vājaṃ cakānāḥ saptirna rathyo aha dhītimaśyāḥ ||
Translation: Men fain to win the prize and glory. May they win, as a car-horse might the goal, your notice.

Sanskit Text: आ ते पितर्मरुतां सुम्नमेतु मा नः सूर्यस्य सन्द्र्षो युयोथाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā te pitarmarutāṃ sumnametu mā naḥ sūryasya sandṛṣo yuyothāḥ |
Translation: 1. FATHER of Maruts, let thy bliss approach us: exclude us not from looking on the sunlight.

Sanskit Text: अभि नो वीरो अर्वति कषमेत पर जायेमहि रुद्र परजाभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi no vīro arvati kṣameta pra jāyemahi rudra prajābhiḥ ||
Translation: Gracious to our fleet courser be the Hero may we transplant us, Rudra, in our children.

Sanskit Text: तवादत्तेभी रुद्र शन्तमेभिः शतं हिमा अशीय भेषजेभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvādattebhī rudra śantamebhiḥ śataṃ himā aśīya bheṣajebhiḥ |
Translation: 2 With the most saving medicines which thou givest, Rudra, may I attain a hundred winters.

Sanskit Text: वयस्मद दवेषो वितरं वयंहो वयमीवाश्चातयस्वा विषूचीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyasmad dveṣo vitaraṃ vyaṃho vyamīvāścātayasvā viṣūcīḥ ||
Translation: Far from us banish enmity and hatred, and to all quarters maladies and trouble.

Sanskit Text: शरेष्ठो जातस्य रुद्र शरियासि तवस्तमस्तवसां वज्रबाहो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śreṣṭho jātasya rudra śriyāsi tavastamastavasāṃ vajrabāho |
Translation: 3 Chief of all born art thou in glory, Rudra, armed with the thunder, mightiest of the mighty.

Sanskit Text: पर्षि णः पारमंहसः सवस्ति विश्वा अभीती रपसो युयोधि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parṣi ṇaḥ pāramaṃhasaḥ svasti viśvā abhītī rapaso yuyodhi ||
Translation: Transport us over trouble to well-being repel thou from us all assaults of mischief.

Sanskit Text: मा तवा रुद्र चुक्रुधामा नमोभिर्मा दुष्टुती वर्षभ मासहूती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā tvā rudra cukrudhāmā namobhirmā duṣṭutī vṛṣabha māsahūtī |
Translation: 4 Let us not anger thee with worship, Rudra, ill praise, Strong God! or mingled invocation.

Sanskit Text: उन नो वीरानर्पय भेषजेभिर्भिषक्तमं तवा भिषजां शर्णोमि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: un no vīrānarpaya bheṣajebhirbhiṣaktamaṃ tvā bhiṣajāṃ śṛṇomi ||
Translation: Do thou with strengthening balms incite our heroes: I hear thee famed as best of all physicians.

Sanskit Text: हवीमभिर्हवते यो हविर्भिरव सतोमेभी रुद्रं दिषीय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: havīmabhirhavate yo havirbhirava stomebhī rudraṃ diṣīya |
Translation: 5 May I with praise-songs win that Rudra's favour who is adored with gifts and invocations.

Sanskit Text: रदूदरः सुहवो मा नो अस्यै बभ्रुः सुशिप्रो रीरधन मनायै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛdūdaraḥ suhavo mā no asyai babhruḥ suśipro rīradhan manāyai ||
Translation: Ne’er may the tawny God, fair-checked, and gracious, swifthearing, yield us to this evil purpose.

Sanskit Text: उन मा ममन्द वर्षभो मरुत्वान तवक्षीयसा वयसा नाधमानम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: un mā mamanda vṛṣabho marutvān tvakṣīyasā vayasā nādhamānam |
Translation: 6 The Strong, begirt by Maruts, hath refreshed me, with most invigorating food, imploring.

Sanskit Text: घर्णीव छायामरपा अशीया विवासेयं रुद्रस्य सुम्नम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛṇīva chāyāmarapā aśīyā vivāseyaṃ rudrasya sumnam ||
Translation: As he who finds a shade in fervent sunlight may I, uninjured, win the bliss of Rudra.

Sanskit Text: कव सय ते रुद्र मर्ळयाकुर्हस्तो यो अस्ति भेषजो जलाषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kva sya te rudra mṛḷayākurhasto yo asti bheṣajo jalāṣaḥ |
Translation: 7 Where is that gracious hand of thine, O Rudra, the hand that giveth health and bringeth comfort,

Sanskit Text: अपभर्ता रपसो दैव्यस्याभी नु मा वर्षभ चक्षमीथाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apabhartā rapaso daivyasyābhī nu mā vṛṣabha cakṣamīthāḥ ||
Translation: Remover of the woe that Gods have sent us? O Strong One, look thou on me with compassion.

Sanskit Text: पर बभ्रवे वर्षभाय शवितीचे महो महीं सुष्टुतिमीरयामि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra babhrave vṛṣabhāya śvitīce maho mahīṃ suṣṭutimīrayāmi |
Translation: 8 To him the strong, great, tawny, fair-complexioned, I utter forth a mighty hymn of praises.

Sanskit Text: नमस्या कल्मलीकिनं नमोभिर्ग्र्णीमसि तवेषं रुद्रस्य नाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: namasyā kalmalīkinaṃ namobhirghṛṇīmasi tveṣaṃ rudrasya nāma ||
Translation: We serve the brilliant God with adorations, we glorify, the splendid name of Rudra.

Sanskit Text: सथिरेभिरङगैः पुरुरूप उग्रो बभ्रुः शुक्रेभिः पिपिशेहिरण्यैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sthirebhiraṅghaiḥ pururūpa ughro babhruḥ śukrebhiḥ pipiśehiraṇyaiḥ |
Translation: 9 With firm limbs, multiform, the strong, the tawny adorns himself with bright gold decorations:

Sanskit Text: ईशानादस्य भुवनस्य भूरेर्न वा उ योषद रुद्रादसुर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: īśānādasya bhuvanasya bhūrerna vā u yoṣad rudrādasuryam ||
Translation: The strength of Godhead ne’er departs from Rudra, him who is Sovran of this world, the mighty.

Sanskit Text: अर्हन बिभर्षि सायकानि धन्वार्हन निष्कं यजतं विश्वरूपम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arhan bibharṣi sāyakāni dhanvārhan niṣkaṃ yajataṃ viśvarūpam |
Translation: 10 Worthy, thou carriest thy bow and arrows, worthy, thy manyhued and honoured necklace.

Sanskit Text: अर्हन्निदं दयसे विश्वमभ्वं न वा ओजीयो रुद्र तवदस्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arhannidaṃ dayase viśvamabhvaṃ na vā ojīyo rudra tvadasti ||
Translation: Worthy, thou cuttest here each fiend to pieces: a mightier than thou there is not, Rudra.

Sanskit Text: सतुहि शरुतं गर्तसदं युवानं मर्गं न भीममुपहत्नुमुग्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stuhi śrutaṃ ghartasadaṃ yuvānaṃ mṛghaṃ na bhīmamupahatnumughram |
Translation: 11 Praise him the chariot-borne, the young, the famous, fierce, slaying like a dread beast of the forest.

Sanskit Text: मर्ला जरित्रे रुद्र सतवानो.अन्यं ते अस्मन नि वपन्तु सेनाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mṛlā jaritre rudra stavāno.anyaṃ te asman ni vapantu senāḥ ||
Translation: O Rudra, praised, be gracious to the singer. let thy hosts spare us and smite down another.

Sanskit Text: कुमारश्चित पितरं वन्दमानं परति नानाम रुद्रोपयन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kumāraścit pitaraṃ vandamānaṃ prati nānāma rudropayantam |
Translation: 12 I bend to thee as thou approachest, Rudra, even as a boy before the sire who greets him.

Sanskit Text: भूरेर्दातारं सत्पतिं गर्णीषे सतुतस्त्वं भेषजा रास्यस्मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūrerdātāraṃ satpatiṃ ghṛṇīṣe stutastvaṃ bheṣajā rāsyasme ||
Translation: I praise thee Bounteous Giver, Lord of heroes: give medicines to us as thou art lauded.

Sanskit Text: या वो भेषजा मरुतः शुचीनि या शन्तमा वर्षणो या मयोभु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā vo bheṣajā marutaḥ śucīni yā śantamā vṛṣaṇo yā mayobhu |
Translation: 13 Of your pure medicines, O potent Maruts, those that are wholesomest and health-bestowing,

Sanskit Text: यानि मनुरव्र्णीता पिता नस्ता शं च योश्चरुद्रस्य वश्मि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāni manuravṛṇītā pitā nastā śaṃ ca yoścarudrasya vaśmi ||
Translation: Those which our father Manu hath selected, I crave from. Rudra for our gain and welfare.

Sanskit Text: परि णो हेती रुद्रस्य वर्ज्याः परि तवेषस्य दुर्मतिर्महीगात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari ṇo hetī rudrasya vṛjyāḥ pari tveṣasya durmatirmahīghāt |
Translation: 14 May Rudra's missile turn aside and spare us, the great wrath of the impetuous One avoid us.

Sanskit Text: अव सथिरा मघवद्भ्यस्तनुष्व मीढ्वस्तोकाय तनयाय मर्ळ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava sthirā maghavadbhyastanuṣva mīḍhvastokāya tanayāya mṛḷa ||
Translation: Turn, Bounteous God, thy strong bow from our princes, and be thou gracious to our seed and offspring.

Sanskit Text: एवा बभ्रो वर्षभ चेकितान यथा देव न हर्णीषे न हंसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā babhro vṛṣabha cekitāna yathā deva na hṛṇīṣe na haṃsi |
Translation: 15 O tawny Bull, thus showing forth thy nature, as neither to be wroth, O God, nor slay us.

Sanskit Text: हवनश्रुन नो रुद्रेह बोधि बर्हद व. व. स. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: havanaśrun no rudreha bodhi bṛhad v. v. s. ||
Translation: Here, Rudra, listen to our invocation. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

Sanskit Text: धारावरा मरुतो धर्ष्ण्वोजसो मर्गा न भीमास्तविषीभिरर्चिनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhārāvarā maruto dhṛṣṇvojaso mṛghā na bhīmāstaviṣībhirarcinaḥ |
Translation: 1. THE Maruts of resistless might who love the rain, resplendent, terrible like wild beasts in their strength,

Sanskit Text: अग्नयो न शुशुचाना रजीषिणो भर्मिं धमन्तोप गा अव्र्ण्वत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnayo na śuśucānā ṛjīṣiṇo bhṛmiṃ dhamantoapa ghā avṛṇvata ||
Translation: Glowing like flames of fire, impetuous in career, blowing the wandering rain-cloud, have disclosed the kine.

Sanskit Text: दयावो न सत्र्भिश्चितयन्त खादिनो वयभ्रिया न दयुतयन्तव्र्ष्टयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyāvo na stṛbhiścitayanta khādino vyabhriyā na dyutayantavṛṣṭayaḥ |
Translation: 2 They gleam with armlets as the heavens are decked with stars, like cloud-born lightnings shine the torrents of their rain.

Sanskit Text: रुद्रो यद वो मरुतो रुक्मवक्षसो वर्षाजनि पर्श्न्याः शुक्र ऊधनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rudro yad vo maruto rukmavakṣaso vṛṣājani pṛśnyāḥ śukra ūdhani ||
Translation: Since the strong Rudra, O Maruts with brilliant chests, sprang into life for you in Pṛśni's radiant lap.

Sanskit Text: उक्षन्ते अश्वानत्यानिवाजिषु नदस्य कर्णैस्तुरयन्त आशुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukṣante aśvānatyānivājiṣu nadasya karṇaisturayanta āśubhiḥ |
Translation: 3 They drip like horses in the racings of swift steeds; with the stream's rapid cars they hasten on their way.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यशिप्रा मरुतो दविध्वतः पर्क्षं याथ पर्षतीभिः समन्यवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyaśiprā maruto davidhvataḥ pṛkṣaṃ yātha pṛṣatībhiḥ samanyavaḥ ||
Translation: Maruts with helms of gold, ye who make all things shake,

Sanskit Text: <a href="errata.htm#12">
come
with your spotted deer, one-minded, to our food.
पर्क्षे ता विश्वा भुवना ववक्षिरे मित्राय वा सदमा जीरदानवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛkṣe tā viśvā bhuvanā vavakṣire mitrāya vā sadamā jīradānavaḥ |
Translation: 4 They have bestowed of Mitra all that live, to feed, they who for evermore cause their swift drops to flow;

Sanskit Text: पर्षदश्वासो अनवभ्रराधस रजिप्यासो न वयुनेषु धूर्षदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛṣadaśvāso anavabhrarādhasa ṛjipyāso na vayuneṣu dhūrṣadaḥ ||
Translation: Whose steeds are spotted deer, whose riches never fail, like horses in full speed, bound to the pole in work.

Sanskit Text: इन्धन्वभिर्धेनुभी रप्शदूधभिरध्वस्मभिः पथिभिर्भ्राजद्र्ष्टयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indhanvabhirdhenubhī rapśadūdhabhiradhvasmabhiḥ pathibhirbhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ |
Translation: 5 With brightly-flaming kine whose udders swell with milk, with glittering lances on your unobstructed paths,

Sanskit Text: आ हंसासो न सवसराणि गन्तन मधोर्मदाय मरुतः समन्यवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā haṃsāso na svasarāṇi ghantana madhormadāya marutaḥ samanyavaḥ ||
