Translation: O Maruts, of one mind, like swans who seek their nests, come to the rapturous enjoyment of the meath.

Sanskit Text: आ नो बरह्माणि मरुतः समन्यवो नरां न शंसः सवनानि गन्तन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no brahmāṇi marutaḥ samanyavo narāṃ na śaṃsaḥ savanāni ghantana |
Translation: 6 To these our prayers, O Maruts, come unanimous, come ye to our libations like the praise of men.

Sanskit Text: अश्वामिव पिप्यत धेनुमूधनि कर्ता धियं जरित्रे वाजपेशसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvāmiva pipyata dhenumūdhani kartā dhiyaṃ jaritre vājapeśasam ||
Translation: Make it swell like a mare, in udder like a cow, and for the singer grace the song with plenteous strength.

Sanskit Text: तं नो दात मरुतो वाजिनं रथ आपानं बरह्म चितयद दिवे-दिवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ no dāta maruto vājinaṃ ratha āpānaṃ brahma citayad dive-dive |
Translation: 7 Give us a steed, O Maruts mighty in the car; prevailing prayer that brings remembrance day by day;

Sanskit Text: इषं सतोत्र्भ्यो वर्जनेषु कारवे सनिं मेधामरिष्टं दुष्टरं सहः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣaṃ stotṛbhyo vṛjaneṣu kārave saniṃ medhāmariṣṭaṃ duṣṭaraṃ sahaḥ ||
Translation: Food to your praisers, to your bard in deeds of might give winning wisdom, power uninjured, unsurpassed.

Sanskit Text: यद युञ्जते मरुतो रुक्मवक्षसो.अश्वान रथेषु भग आ सुदानवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad yuñjate maruto rukmavakṣaso.aśvān ratheṣu bhagha ā sudānavaḥ |
Translation: 8 When the bright-chested Maruts, lavish of their gifts, bind at the time bliss their horses to the cars,

Sanskit Text: धेनुर्न शिश्वे सवसरेषु पिन्वते जनाय रातहविषे महीमिषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhenurna śiśve svasareṣu pinvate janāya rātahaviṣe mahīmiṣam ||
Translation: Then, as the milch-cow feeds her calf within the stalls, they pour forth food for all oblation-bringing men.

Sanskit Text: यो नो मरुतो वर्कताति मर्त्यो रिपुर्दधे वसवो रक्षता रिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo no maruto vṛkatāti martyo ripurdadhe vasavo rakṣatā riṣaḥ |
Translation: 9 Save us, O Maruts, Vasus, from the injurer, the mortal foe who makes us looked upon as wolves.

Sanskit Text: वर्तयत तपुषा चक्रियाभि तमव रुद्रा अशसो हन्तना वधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vartayata tapuṣā cakriyābhi tamava rudrā aśaso hantanā vadhaḥ ||
Translation: With chariot all aflame compass him round about: O Rudras, cast away the foeman's deadly bolt.

Sanskit Text: चित्रं तद वो मरुतो याम चेकिते पर्श्न्या यदूधरप्यापयो दुहुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: citraṃ tad vo maruto yāma cekite pṛśnyā yadūdharapyāpayo duhuḥ |
Translation: 10 Well-known, ye Maruts, is that wondrous course of yours, when they milked Pṛśni's udder, close akin to her.

Sanskit Text: यद वा निदे नवमानस्य रुद्रियास्त्रितं जरायजुरतामदाभ्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā nide navamānasya rudriyāstritaṃ jarāyajuratāmadābhyāḥ ||
Translation: Or when to shame the bard who lauded, Rudra's Sons, ye O infallible brought Trita to decay.

Sanskit Text: तान वो महो मरुत एवयाव्नो विष्णोरेषस्य परभ्र्थे हवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tān vo maho maruta evayāvno viṣṇoreṣasya prabhṛthe havāmahe |
Translation: 11 We call you such, great Maruts, following wonted ways, to the oblation paid to Viṣṇu Speeder-on.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यवर्णान ककुहान यतस्रुचो बरह्मण्यन्तः शंस्यं राध ईमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyavarṇān kakuhān yatasruco brahmaṇyantaḥ śaṃsyaṃ rādha īmahe ||
Translation: With ladles lifted up, with prayer, we seek of them preeminent, golden-hued, the wealth which all extol.

Sanskit Text: ते दशग्वाः परथमा यज्ञमूहिरे ते नो हिन्वन्तूषसो वयुष्टिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te daśaghvāḥ prathamā yajñamūhire te no hinvantūṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu |
Translation: 12 They, the Daśagvas, first of all brought sacrifice: they at the break of mornings shall inspirit us.

Sanskit Text: उषा न रामीररुणैरपोर्णुते महो जयोतिषाशुचता गोर्णसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣā na rāmīraruṇairaporṇute maho jyotiṣāśucatā ghoarṇasā ||
Translation: Dawn with her purple beams uncovereth the nights, with great light glowing like a billowy sea of milk.

Sanskit Text: ते कषोणीभिररुणेभिर्नाञ्जिभी रुद्रा रतस्य सदनेषुवाव्र्धुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te kṣoṇībhiraruṇebhirnāñjibhī rudrā ṛtasya sadaneṣuvāvṛdhuḥ |
Translation: 13 The Rudras have rejoiced them in the gathered bands at seats of worship as in purple ornaments.

Sanskit Text: निमेघमाना अत्येन पाजसा सुश्चन्द्रं वर्णन्दधिरे सुपेशसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nimeghamānā atyena pājasā suścandraṃ varṇandadhire supeśasam ||
Translation: They with impetuous vigour sending down the rain have taken to themselves a bright and lovely hue.

Sanskit Text: तानियानो महि वरूथमूतय उप घेदेना नमसा गर्णीमसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāniyāno mahi varūthamūtaya upa ghedenā namasā ghṛṇīmasi |
Translation: 14 Soliciting their high protection for our help, with this our adoration we sing praise to them,

Sanskit Text: तरितो न यान पञ्च होतॄनभिष्टय आववर्तदवराञ्चक्रियावसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trito na yān pañca hotṝnabhiṣṭaya āvavartadavarāñcakriyāvase ||
Translation: Whom, for assistance, like the five terrestrial priests. Trita hath brought to aid us hither on his car.

Sanskit Text: यया रध्रं पारयथात्यंहो यया निदो मुञ्चथ वन्दितारम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayā radhraṃ pārayathātyaṃho yayā nido muñcatha vanditāram |
Translation: 15 So may your favouring help be turned to us-ward, your kindness like a lowing cow approach us,

Sanskit Text: अर्वाची सा मरुतो या व ऊतिरो षु वाश्रेव सुमतिर्जिगातु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvācī sā maruto yā va ūtiro ṣu vāśreva sumatirjighātu ||
Translation: Wherewith ye bear your servant over trouble, and free your worshipper from scoff and scorning.

Sanskit Text: उपेमस्र्क्षि वाजयुर्वचस्यां चनो दधीत नाद्यो गिरो मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upemasṛkṣi vājayurvacasyāṃ cano dadhīta nādyo ghiro me |
Translation: 1. EAGER for spoil my flow of speech I utter: may the Floods' Child accept my songs with favour.

Sanskit Text: अपां नपादाशुहेमा कुवित स सुपेशसस करति जोषिषद धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāṃ napādāśuhemā kuvit sa supeśasas karati joṣiṣad dhi ||
Translation: Will not the rapid Son of Waters make them lovely, for he it is who shall enjoy them?

Sanskit Text: इमं सवस्मै हर्द आ सुतष्टं मन्त्रं वोचेम कुविदस्य वेदत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ svasmai hṛda ā sutaṣṭaṃ mantraṃ vocema kuvidasya vedat |
Translation: 2 To him let us address the song well-fashioned, forth from the heart. Shall he not understand it'

Sanskit Text: अपां नपादसुर्यस्य मह्ना विश्वान्यर्यो भुवना जजान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāṃ napādasuryasya mahnā viśvānyaryo bhuvanā jajāna ||
Translation: The friendly Son of Waters by the greatness of Godhead hath produced all things existing.

Sanskit Text: समन्या यन्त्युप यन्त्यन्याः समानमूर्वं नद्यः पर्णन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samanyā yantyupa yantyanyāḥ samānamūrvaṃ nadyaḥ pṛṇanti |
Translation: 3 Some floods unite themselves and others join them: die sounding rivers fill one common storehouse.

Sanskit Text: तमू शुचिं शुचयो दीदिवांसमपां नपातं परि तस्थुरापः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamū śuciṃ śucayo dīdivāṃsamapāṃ napātaṃ pari tasthurāpaḥ ||
Translation: On every side the bright Floods have encompassed the bright resplendent Offspring of the Waters.

Sanskit Text: तमस्मेरा युवतयो युवानं मर्म्र्ज्यमानाः परि यन्त्यापः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamasmerā yuvatayo yuvānaṃ marmṛjyamānāḥ pari yantyāpaḥ |
Translation: 4 The never-sullen waters, youthful Maidens, carefully decking, wait on him the youthful.

Sanskit Text: स शुक्रेभिः शिक्वभी रेवदस्मे दीदायानिध्मो घर्तनिर्णिगप्सु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa śukrebhiḥ śikvabhī revadasme dīdāyānidhmo ghṛtanirṇighapsu ||
Translation: He with bright rays shines forth in splendid beauty, unfed with wood, in waters, oil-enveloped.

Sanskit Text: अस्मै तिस्रो अव्यथ्याय नारीर्देवाय देवीर्दिधिषन्त्यन्नम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmai tisro avyathyāya nārīrdevāya devīrdidhiṣantyannam |
Translation: 5 To him three Dames are offering food to feed him, Goddesses to the God whom none may injure.

Sanskit Text: कर्ता इवोप हि परसर्स्रे अप्सु स पीयूषं धयति पूर्वसूनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛtā ivopa hi prasarsre apsu sa pīyūṣaṃ dhayati pūrvasūnām ||
Translation: Within the waters hath he pressed, as hollows, and drinks their milk who now are first made mothers.

Sanskit Text: अश्वस्यात्र जनिमास्य च सवर्द्रुहो रिषः सम्प्र्चः पाहिसूरीन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvasyātra janimāsya ca svardruho riṣaḥ sampṛcaḥ pāhisūrīn |
Translation: 6 Here was the horse's birth; his was the sunlight. Save thou our princes from the oppressor's onslaught.

Sanskit Text: आमासु पूर्षु परो अप्रम्र्ष्यं नारातयो वि नशन नान्र्तानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āmāsu pūrṣu paro apramṛṣyaṃ nārātayo vi naśan nānṛtāni ||
Translation: Him, indestructible, dwelling at a distance in forts unwrought lies and ill spirits reach not.

Sanskit Text: सव आ दमे सुदुघा यस्य धेनुः सवधां पीपाय सुभ्वन्नमत्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sva ā dame sudughā yasya dhenuḥ svadhāṃ pīpāya subhvannamatti |
Translation: 7 He, in whose mansion is the teeming Milch-cow, swells the Gods’ nectar and cats noble viands.

Sanskit Text: सो अपां नपादूर्जयन्नप्स्वन्तर्वसुदेयाय विधते वि भाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: so apāṃ napādūrjayannapsvantarvasudeyāya vidhate vi bhāti ||
Translation: The Son of Waters, gathering strength in waters, shines for his worshipper to give him treasures.

Sanskit Text: यो अप्स्वा सुचिना दैव्येन रतावाजस्र उर्विया विभाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo apsvā sucinā daivyena ṛtāvājasra urviyā vibhāti |
Translation: 8 He who in waters with his own pure Godhead shines widely, law-abiding, everlasting—

Sanskit Text: वया इदन्या भुवनान्यस्य पर जायन्ते वीरुधश्च परजाभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayā idanyā bhuvanānyasya pra jāyante vīrudhaśca prajābhiḥ ||
Translation: The other worlds are verily his branches, and plants are born of him with all their offspring.

Sanskit Text: अपां नपादा हयस्थादुपस्थं जिह्मानामूर्ध्वो विद्युतं वसानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāṃ napādā hyasthādupasthaṃ jihmānāmūrdhvo vidyutaṃ vasānaḥ |
Translation: 9 The Waters’ Son hath risen, and clothed in lightning ascended up unto the curled cloud's bosom;

Sanskit Text: तस्य जयेष्ठं महिमानं वहन्तीर्हिरण्यवर्णाः परि यन्ति यह्वीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya jyeṣṭhaṃ mahimānaṃ vahantīrhiraṇyavarṇāḥ pari yanti yahvīḥ ||
Translation: And bearing with them his supremest glory the Youthful Ones, gold-coloured, move around him.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यरूपः स हिरण्यसन्द्र्गपां नपात सेदु हिरण्यवर्णः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyarūpaḥ sa hiraṇyasandṛghapāṃ napāt sedu hiraṇyavarṇaḥ |
Translation: 10 Golden in form is he, like gold to look on, his colour is like gold, the Son of Waters.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्ययात परि योनेर्निषद्या हिरण्यदा ददत्यन्नमस्मै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyayāt pari yonerniṣadyā hiraṇyadā dadatyannamasmai ||
Translation: When he is seated fresh from golden birthplace those who present their gold give food to feed him.

Sanskit Text: तदस्यानीकमुत चारु नामापीच्यं वर्धते नप्तुरपाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadasyānīkamuta cāru nāmāpīcyaṃ vardhate napturapām |
Translation: 11 This the fair name and this the lovely aspect of him the Waters’ Son increase in secret.

Sanskit Text: यमिन्धते युवतयः समित्था हिरण्यवर्णं घर्तमन्नमस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamindhate yuvatayaḥ samitthā hiraṇyavarṇaṃ ghṛtamannamasya ||
Translation: Whom here the youthful Maids together kindle, his food is sacred oil of golden colour.

Sanskit Text: अस्मै बहूनामवमाय सख्ये यज्ञैर्विधेम नमसा हविर्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmai bahūnāmavamāya sakhye yajñairvidhema namasā havirbhiḥ |
Translation: 12 Him, nearest Friend of many, will we worship with sacrifice. and reverence and oblation.

Sanskit Text: सं सानु मार्ज्मि दिधिषामि बिल्मैर्दधाम्यन्नैःपरि वन्द रग्भिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ sānu mārjmi didhiṣāmi bilmairdadhāmyannaiḥpari vanda ṛghbhiḥ ||
Translation: I make his back to shine, with chips provide him; I offer food and with my songs exalt him.

Sanskit Text: स ईं वर्षाजनयत तासु गर्भं स ईं सिशुर्धयति तं रिहन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa īṃ vṛṣājanayat tāsu gharbhaṃ sa īṃ siśurdhayati taṃ rihanti |
Translation: 13 The Bull hath laid his own life-germ Within them. He sucks them as an infant, and they kiss him.

Sanskit Text: सो अपां नपादनभिम्लातवर्णो.अन्यस्येवेह तन्वा विवेष ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: so apāṃ napādanabhimlātavarṇo.anyasyeveha tanvā viveṣa ||
Translation: He, Son of Waters, of unfading colour, hath entered here as in another's body.

Sanskit Text: अस्मिन पदे परमे तस्थिवांसमध्वस्मभिर्विश्वहा दीदिवांसाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmin pade parame tasthivāṃsamadhvasmabhirviśvahā dīdivāṃsām |
Translation: 14 While here he dwelleth in sublimest station, resplendent with the rays that never perish,

Sanskit Text: आपो नप्त्रे घर्तमन्नं वहन्तीः सवयमत्कैः परि दीयन्ति यह्वीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpo naptre ghṛtamannaṃ vahantīḥ svayamatkaiḥ pari dīyanti yahvīḥ ||
Translation: The Waters, bearing oil to feed their offspring, flow, Youthful Ones, in wanderings about him.

Sanskit Text: अयांसमग्ने सुक्षितिं जनायायांसमु मघवद्भ्यः सुव्र्क्तिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayāṃsamaghne sukṣitiṃ janāyāyāṃsamu maghavadbhyaḥ suvṛktim |
Translation: 15 Agni, I gave good shelter to the people, and to the princes goodly preparation.

Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvaṃ tad ... ||
Translation: Blessed is all that Gods regard with favour. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्यं हिन्वानो वसिष्ट गा अपो.अधुक्षन सीमविभिरद्रिभिर्नरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyaṃ hinvāno vasiṣṭa ghā apo.adhukṣan sīmavibhiradribhirnaraḥ |
Translation: 1. WATER and milk hath he endued, sent forth to thee: the men have drained him with the filters and the stones.

Sanskit Text: पिबेन्द्र सवाहा परहुतं वषत्क्र्तं होत्रादासोमं परथमो य ईशिषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibendra svāhā prahutaṃ vaṣatkṛtaṃ hotrādāsomaṃ prathamo ya īśiṣe ||
Translation: Drink, Indra, from the Hotar's bowl—first right is thine—Soma hallowed and poured with Vaṣaṭ and Svāhā.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञैः सम्मिश्लाः पर्षतीभिर्र्ष्टिभिर्यामञ्छुभ्रासो अञ्जिषु परिया उत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñaiḥ sammiślāḥ pṛṣatībhirṛṣṭibhiryāmañchubhrāso añjiṣu priyā uta |
Translation: 2 Busied with sacrifice, with spotted deer and spears, gleaming upon your way with ornaments, yea, our Friends,

Sanskit Text: आसद्या बर्हिर्भरतस्य सूनवः पोत्रादा सोमं पिबता दिवो नरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsadyā barhirbharatasya sūnavaḥ potrādā somaṃ pibatā divo naraḥ ||
Translation: Sitting on sacred grass, ye Sons of Bhārata, drink Soma from the Potar's bowl, O Men of heaven.

Sanskit Text: अमेव नः सुहवा आ हि गन्तन नि बर्हिषि सदतना रणिष्टन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ameva naḥ suhavā ā hi ghantana ni barhiṣi sadatanā raṇiṣṭana |
Translation: 3 Come unto us, ye swift to listen: as at home upon the sacred grass sit and enjoy yourselves.

Sanskit Text: अथा मन्दस्व जुजुषाणो अन्धसस्त्वष्टर्देवेभिर्जनिभिः सुमद्गणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā mandasva jujuṣāṇo andhasastvaṣṭardevebhirjanibhiḥ sumadghaṇaḥ ||
Translation: And, Tvaṣṭar, well-content be joyful in the juice with Gods and Goddesses in gladsome company.

Sanskit Text: आ वक्षि देवानिह विप्र यक्षि चोशन होतर्नि षदा योनिषु तरिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vakṣi devāniha vipra yakṣi cośan hotarni ṣadā yoniṣu triṣu |
Translation: 4 Bring the Gods hither, Sage, and offer sacrifice: at the three altars seat thee willingly, O Priest.

Sanskit Text: परति वीहि परस्थितं सोम्यं मधु पिबाग्नीध्रात्तव भागस्य तर्प्णुहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati vīhi prasthitaṃ somyaṃ madhu pibāghnīdhrāttava bhāghasya tṛpṇuhi ||
Translation: Accept for thy delight the proffered Soma meath: drink from the Kindler's bowl and fill thee with thy share.

Sanskit Text: एष सय ते तन्वो नर्म्णवर्धनः सह ओजः परदिवि बाह्वोर्हितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa sya te tanvo nṛmṇavardhanaḥ saha ojaḥ pradivi bāhvorhitaḥ |
Translation: 5 This is the strengthener of thy body's manly might: strength, victory for all time are placed within thine arms.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्यं सुतो मघवन तुभ्यमाभ्र्तस्त्वमस्य बराह्मनादा तर्पत पिब ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyaṃ suto maghavan tubhyamābhṛtastvamasya brāhmanādā tṛpat piba ||
Translation: Pressed for thee, Maghavan, it is offered unto thee: drink from the chalice of this Brahman, drink thy fill.

Sanskit Text: जुषेथां यज्ञं बोधतं हवस्य मे सत्तो होता निविदः पूर्व्या अनु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣethāṃ yajñaṃ bodhataṃ havasya me satto hotā nividaḥ pūrvyā anu |
Translation: 6 Accept the sacrifice; mark both of you, my call: the Priest hath seated him after the ancient texts.

Sanskit Text: अछा राजाना नम एत्याव्र्तं परशास्त्रादा पिबतं सोम्यं मधु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā rājānā nama etyāvṛtaṃ praśāstrādā pibataṃ somyaṃ madhu ||
Translation: My prayer that bids them come goes forth to both the Kings: drink ye the Soma meath from the Director's bowl.

Sanskit Text: मन्दस्व होत्रादनु जोषमन्धसो.अध्वर्यवः स पूर्णांवष्ट्यासिचम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mandasva hotrādanu joṣamandhaso.adhvaryavaḥ sa pūrṇāṃvaṣṭyāsicam |
Translation: 1. Enjoy thy fill of meath out of the Hotar's cup: Adhvaryus he desires a full draught poured for him.

Sanskit Text: तस्मा एतं भरत तद्वशो ददिर्होत्राद सोमं दरविणोदः पिब रतुभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmā etaṃ bharata tadvaśo dadirhotrād somaṃ draviṇodaḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ ||
Translation: Bring it him: seeking this he gives. Granter of Wealth, drink Soma with the Ṛtus from the Hotar's cup.

Sanskit Text: यमु पूर्वमहुवे तमिदं हुवे सेदु हव्यो ददिर्यो नाम पत्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamu pūrvamahuve tamidaṃ huve sedu havyo dadiryo nāma patyate |
Translation: 2 He whom of old I called on, him I call on now. He is to be invoked; his name is He who Gives,

Sanskit Text: अध्वर्युभिः परस्थितं सोम्यं मधु पोत्रात सोमं द. प. र. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhvaryubhiḥ prasthitaṃ somyaṃ madhu potrāt somaṃ d. p. ṛ. ||
Translation: Here brought by priests is Soma meath. Granter of Wealth, drink Soma with the Ṛtus from the Potar's cup.

Sanskit Text: मेद्यन्तु ते वह्नयो येभिरीयसे.अरिषण्यन वीळयस्वा वनस्पते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: medyantu te vahnayo yebhirīyase.ariṣaṇyan vīḷayasvā vanaspate |
Translation: 3 Fat may the horses be wherewith thou speedest on: Lord of the Wood, unharming, strengthen thou thyself.

Sanskit Text: आयूया धर्ष्णो अभिगूर्या तवं नेष्ट्रात सोमं ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āyūyā dhṛṣṇo abhighūryā tvaṃ neṣṭrāt somaṃ ... ||
Translation: Drawing and seizing, Bold One, thou who grantest wealth, drink Soma with the Ṛtus from the Neṣṭar's cup.

Sanskit Text: अपाद धोत्रादुत पोत्रादमत्तोत नेष्ट्रादजुषत परयो हितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apād dhotrāduta potrādamattota neṣṭrādajuṣata prayo hitam |
Translation: 4 From Hotar's cup and Potar's he hath drunk and joyed: the proffered food hath pleased him from the Neṣṭar's bowl.

Sanskit Text: तुरीयं पात्रमम्र्क्तममर्त्यं दरविणोदाः पिबतु दराविणोदसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: turīyaṃ pātramamṛktamamartyaṃ draviṇodāḥ pibatu drāviṇodasaḥ ||
Translation: The fourth cup undisturbed, immortal, let him drink who giveth wealth, the cup of the wealth-giving God.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाञ्चमद्य यय्यं नर्वाहणं रथं युञ्जाथामिह वां विमोचनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāñcamadya yayyaṃ nṛvāhaṇaṃ rathaṃ yuñjāthāmiha vāṃ vimocanam |
Translation: 5 Yoke, O ye Twain, to-day your hero-bearing car, swift-moving hitherward: your loosing-place is here.

Sanskit Text: पर्ङकतं हवींषि मधुना हि कं गतमथा सोमं पिबतं वाजिनीवसू ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛṅktaṃ havīṃṣi madhunā hi kaṃ ghatamathā somaṃ pibataṃ vājinīvasū ||
Translation: Mix the oblations, then come hither with the meath, and drink the Soma, ye rich in abundant strength.

Sanskit Text: जोष्यग्ने समिधं जोष्याहुतिं जोषि बरह्म जन्यं जोषिसुष्टुतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: joṣyaghne samidhaṃ joṣyāhutiṃ joṣi brahma janyaṃ joṣisuṣṭutim |
Translation: 6 Agni, accept the fuel and our offered gift: accept the prayer of man, accept our eulogy,

Sanskit Text: विश्वेभिर्विश्वान रतुना वसो मह उशन देवानुशतः पायया हविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvebhirviśvān ṛtunā vaso maha uśan devānuśataḥ pāyayā haviḥ ||
Translation: Do thou with all, with Ṛtu, O thou Excellent, fain, make the great Gods all fain taste the gift we bring.

Sanskit Text: उदु षय देवः सविता सवाय शश्वत्तमं तदपा वह्निरस्थात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udu ṣya devaḥ savitā savāya śaśvattamaṃ tadapā vahnirasthāt |
Translation: 1. UPRISEN is Savitar, this God, to quicken, Priest who neglects not this most constant duty.

Sanskit Text: नूनं देवेभ्यो वि हि धाति रत्नमथाभजद वीतिहोत्रं सवस्तौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nūnaṃ devebhyo vi hi dhāti ratnamathābhajad vītihotraṃ svastau ||
Translation: To the Gods, verily, he gives rich treasure, and blesses him who calls them to the banquet.

Sanskit Text: विश्वस्य हि शरुष्टये देव ऊर्ध्वः पर बाहवा पर्थुपाणिः सिसर्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvasya hi śruṣṭaye deva ūrdhvaḥ pra bāhavā pṛthupāṇiḥ sisarti |
Translation: 2 Having gone up on high, the God broad-handed spreads his arms widely forth that all may mark him.

Sanskit Text: आपश्चिदस्य वरत आ निम्र्ग्रा अयं चिद वातो रमते परिज्मन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpaścidasya vrata ā nimṛghrā ayaṃ cid vāto ramate parijman ||
Translation: Even the waters bend them to his service: even this wind rests in the circling region.

Sanskit Text: आशुभिश्चिद यान वि मुचाति नूनमरीरमदतमानं चिदेतोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āśubhiścid yān vi mucāti nūnamarīramadatamānaṃ cidetoḥ |
Translation: 3 Though borne by swift steeds he will yet unyoke them: e’en the fleet chariot hath he stayed from going.

Sanskit Text: अह्यर्षूणां चिन नययानविष्यामनु वरतं सवितुर्मोक्यागात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahyarṣūṇāṃ cin nyayānaviṣyāmanu vrataṃ saviturmokyāghāt ||
Translation: He hath checked e’en their haste who glide like serpents. Night closely followed Savitar's dominion.

Sanskit Text: पुनः समव्यद विततं वयन्ती मध्या कर्तोर्न्यधाच्छक्म धीरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: punaḥ samavyad vitataṃ vayantī madhyā kartornyadhācchakma dhīraḥ |
Translation: 4 What was spread out she weaves afresh, re-weaving: the skilful leaves his labour half-completed.

Sanskit Text: उत संहायास्थाद वय रतूं अदर्धररमतिःसविता देव आगात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut saṃhāyāsthād vy ṛtūṃ adardhararamatiḥsavitā deva āghāt ||
Translation: He hath arisen from rest, and parted seasons: Savitar hath approached, God, holy-minded.

Sanskit Text: नानौकांसि दुर्यो विश्वमायुर्वि तिष्ठते परभवः शोको अग्नेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nānaukāṃsi duryo viśvamāyurvi tiṣṭhate prabhavaḥ śoko aghneḥ |
Translation: 5 Through various dwellings, through entire existence, spreads, manifest, the household light of Agni.

Sanskit Text: जयेष्ठं माता सूनवे भागमाधादन्वस्यकेतमिषितं सवित्रा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyeṣṭhaṃ mātā sūnave bhāghamādhādanvasyaketamiṣitaṃ savitrā ||
Translation: The Mother gives her Son the goodliest portion, and Savitar hath sped to meet his summons.

Sanskit Text: समाववर्ति विष्ठितो जिगीषुर्विश्वेषां कामश्चरताममाभूत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samāvavarti viṣṭhito jighīṣurviśveṣāṃ kāmaścaratāmamābhūt |
Translation: 6 He comes again, unfolded, fain for conquest: at home was he, the love of all things moving.

Sanskit Text: शश्वानपो विक्र्तं हित्व्यागादनु वरतं सवितुर्दैव्यस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaśvānapo vikṛtaṃ hitvyāghādanu vrataṃ saviturdaivyasya ||
Translation: Each man hath come leaving his evil doings, after the Godlike Savitar's commandment.

Sanskit Text: तवया हितमप्यमप्सु भागं धन्वान्वा मर्गयसो वि तस्थुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā hitamapyamapsu bhāghaṃ dhanvānvā mṛghayaso vi tasthuḥ |
Translation: 7 The wild beasts spread through desert places seeking their watery share which thou hast set in waters.

Sanskit Text: वनानि विभ्यो नकिरस्य तानि वरता देवस्य सवितुर्मिनन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanāni vibhyo nakirasya tāni vratā devasya saviturminanti ||
Translation: The woods are given to the birds. These statutes of the God Savitar none disobeyeth.

Sanskit Text: याद्राध्यं वरुणो योनिमप्यमनिशितं निमिषि जर्भुराणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yādrādhyaṃ varuṇo yonimapyamaniśitaṃ nimiṣi jarbhurāṇaḥ |
Translation: 8 With utmost speed, in restless haste at sunset Varuṇa seeks his watery habitation.

Sanskit Text: विश्वो मार्ताण्डो वरजमा पशुर्गात सथशो जन्मानि सविता वयाकः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvo mārtāṇḍo vrajamā paśurghāt sthaśo janmāni savitā vyākaḥ ||
Translation: Then seeks each bird his nest, each beast his lodging. In due place Savitar hath set each creature.

Sanskit Text: न यस्येन्द्रो वरुणो न मित्रो वरतमर्यमा न मिनन्ति रुद्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yasyendro varuṇo na mitro vratamaryamā na minanti rudraḥ |
Translation: 9 Him whose high law not Varuṇa nor Indra, not Mitra, Aryaman, nor Rudra breaketh,

Sanskit Text: नारातयस्तमिदं सवस्ति हुवे देवं सवितारं नमोभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nārātayastamidaṃ svasti huve devaṃ savitāraṃ namobhiḥ ||
Translation: Nor evil-hearted fiends, here for my welfare him I invoke, God Savitar, with worship.

Sanskit Text: भगं धियं वाजयन्तः पुरन्धिं नराशंसो गनास्पतिर्नो अव्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhaghaṃ dhiyaṃ vājayantaḥ purandhiṃ narāśaṃso ghnāspatirno avyāḥ |
Translation: 10 May they who strengthen bliss, and thought and wisdom, and the Dames’ Lord and Narāśaṁsa aid us.

Sanskit Text: आये वामस्य संगथे रयीणां परिया देवस्य सवितुः सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āye vāmasya saṃghathe rayīṇāṃ priyā devasya savituḥ syāma ||
Translation: That good may come to us and wealth be gathered, may we be Savitar the God's beloved.

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं तद दिवो अद्भ्यः पर्थिव्यास्त्वया दत्तं काम्यं राध आ गात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ tad divo adbhyaḥ pṛthivyāstvayā dattaṃ kāmyaṃ rādha ā ghāt |
Translation: 11 So come to us our hearts' desire, the bounty bestowed by thee, from heaven and earth and waters,

Sanskit Text: शं यत सतोत्र्भ्य आपये भवात्युरुशंसाय सवितर्जरित्रे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ yat stotṛbhya āpaye bhavātyuruśaṃsāya savitarjaritre ||
Translation: That it be well with friends and those who praise thee, and, Savitar, with the loud-lauding singer.

Sanskit Text: गरावाणेव तदिदथं जरेथे गर्ध्रेव वर्क्षं निधिमन्तमछ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghrāvāṇeva tadidathaṃ jarethe ghṛdhreva vṛkṣaṃ nidhimantamacha |
Translation: 1. SING like the two press-stones for this same purpose; come like two misers to the tree of treasure;

Sanskit Text: बरह्माणेव विदथ उक्थशासा दूतेव हव्या जन्या पुरुत्रा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmāṇeva vidatha ukthaśāsā dūteva havyā janyā purutrā ||
Translation: Like two laud-singing Brahmans in the assembly, like the folk's envoys called in many places.

Sanskit Text: परातर्यावाणा रथ्येव वीराजेव यमा वरमा सचेथे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātaryāvāṇā rathyeva vīrājeva yamā varamā sacethe |
Translation: 2 Moving at morning like two car-borne heroes, like to a pair of goats ye come electing;

Sanskit Text: मेने इव तन्वा शुम्भमाने दम्पतीव करतुविदा जनेषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mene iva tanvā śumbhamāne dampatīva kratuvidā janeṣu ||
Translation: Like two fair dames embellishing their bodies, like a wise married pair among the people.

Sanskit Text: शर्ङगेव नः परथमा गन्तमर्वाक छफाविव जर्भुराणातरोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṅgheva naḥ prathamā ghantamarvāk chaphāviva jarbhurāṇātarobhiḥ |
Translation: 3 Like to a pair of horns come first to us-ward, like to a pair of hoofs with rapid motion;

Sanskit Text: चक्रवाकेव परति वस्तोरुस्रार्वाञ्चा यातं रथ्येव शक्रा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakravākeva prati vastorusrārvāñcā yātaṃ rathyeva śakrā ||
Translation: Come like two Cakavās in the grey of morning, come like two chariot wheels at dawn, ye Mighty.

Sanskit Text: नावेव नः पारयतं युगेव नभ्येव न उपधीव परधीव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāveva naḥ pārayataṃ yugheva nabhyeva na upadhīva pradhīva |
Translation: 4 Bear us across the rivers like two vessels, save us as ye were yokes, naves, spokes and fellies.

Sanskit Text: शवानेव नो अरिषण्या तनूनां खर्गलेव विस्रसः पातमस्मान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śvāneva no ariṣaṇyā tanūnāṃ khṛghaleva visrasaḥ pātamasmān ||
Translation: Be like two dogs that injure not our bodies; preserve us, like two crutches, that we fall not.

Sanskit Text: वातेवाजुर्या नद्येव रीतिरक्षी इव चक्षुषा यातमर्वाक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vātevājuryā nadyeva rītirakṣī iva cakṣuṣā yātamarvāk |
Translation: 5 Like two winds ageing not, two confluent rivers, come with quick vision like two eyes before us.

Sanskit Text: हस्ताविव तन्वे शम्भविष्ठा पादेव नो नयतं वस्यो अछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hastāviva tanve śambhaviṣṭhā pādeva no nayataṃ vasyo acha ||
Translation: Come like two hands most helpful to the body, and guide us like two feet to what is precious.

Sanskit Text: ओष्ठाविव मध्वास्ने वदन्ता सतनाविव पिप्यतं जीवसेनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: oṣṭhāviva madhvāsne vadantā stanāviva pipyataṃ jīvasenaḥ |
Translation: 6 Even as two lips that with the mouth speak honey, even as two breasts that nourish our existence,

Sanskit Text: नासेव नस्तन्वो रक्षितारा कर्णाविव सुश्रुता भूतमस्मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāseva nastanvo rakṣitārā karṇāviva suśrutā bhūtamasme ||
Translation: Like the two nostrils that protect our being, be to us as our ears that hear distinctly.

Sanskit Text: हस्तेव शक्तिमभि सन्ददी नः कषामेव नः समजतं रजांसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hasteva śaktimabhi sandadī naḥ kṣāmeva naḥ samajataṃ rajāṃsi |
Translation: 7 Like two hands give ye us increasing vigour; like heaven and earth constrain the airy regions.

Sanskit Text: इमा गिरो अश्विना युष्मयन्तीः कष्णोत्रेणेव सवधितिं सं शिशीतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā ghiro aśvinā yuṣmayantīḥ kṣṇotreṇeva svadhitiṃ saṃ śiśītam ||
Translation: Aśvins, these hymns that struggle to approach you, sharpen ye like an axe upon a whetstone.

Sanskit Text: एतानि वामश्विना वर्धनानि बरह्म सतोमं गर्त्समदासो अक्रन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etāni vāmaśvinā vardhanāni brahma stomaṃ ghṛtsamadāso akran |
Translation: 8 These prayers of ours exalting you, O Aśvins, have the Gṛtsamadas, for a laud, made ready.

Sanskit Text: तानि नरा जुजुषाणोप यातं बर्हद ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāni narā jujuṣāṇopa yātaṃ bṛhad ... ||
Translation: Welcome them, O ye Heroes, and come hither. Loud may we speak. with brave men, in assembly.

Sanskit Text: सोमापूषणा जनना रयीणां जनना दिवो जनना पर्थिव्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somāpūṣaṇā jananā rayīṇāṃ jananā divo jananā pṛthivyāḥ |
Translation: 1 SOMA and Pūṣan, Parents of all riches, Parents of earth and Parents of high heaven,

Sanskit Text: जातौ विश्वस्य भुवनस्य गोपौ देवा अक्र्ण्वन्नम्र्तस्य नाभिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jātau viśvasya bhuvanasya ghopau devā akṛṇvannamṛtasya nābhim ||
Translation: You Twain, brought forth as the whole world's protectors, the Gods have made centre of life eternal.

Sanskit Text: इमौ देवौ जायमानौ जुषन्तेमौ तमांसि गूहतामजुष्टा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imau devau jāyamānau juṣantemau tamāṃsi ghūhatāmajuṣṭā |
Translation: 2 At birth of these two Gods all Gods are joyful: they have caused darkness, which we hate, to vanish.

Sanskit Text: आभ्यामिन्द्रः पक्वमामास्वन्तः सोमापूषभ्यां जनदुस्रियासु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ābhyāmindraḥ pakvamāmāsvantaḥ somāpūṣabhyāṃ janadusriyāsu ||
Translation: With these, with Soma and with Pūṣan, India generates ripe warm milk in the raw milch-cows.

Sanskit Text: सोमापूषणा रजसो विमानं सप्तचक्रं रथमविश्वमिन्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somāpūṣaṇā rajaso vimānaṃ saptacakraṃ rathamaviśvaminvam |
Translation: 3 Soma and Pūṣan, urge your chariot hither, the seven-wheeled car that measures out the region,

Sanskit Text: विषूव्र्तं मनसा युज्यमानं तं जिन्वथो वर्षणा पञ्चरश्मिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viṣūvṛtaṃ manasā yujyamānaṃ taṃ jinvatho vṛṣaṇā pañcaraśmim ||
Translation: That stirs not all, that moves to every quarter, five-reined and harnessed by the thought, ye Mighty.

Sanskit Text: दिव्यन्यः सदनं चक्र उच्चा पर्थिव्यामन्यो अध्यन्तरिक्षे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divyanyaḥ sadanaṃ cakra uccā pṛthivyāmanyo adhyantarikṣe |
Translation: 4 One in the heaven on high hath made his dwelling, on earth and in the firmament the other.

Sanskit Text: तावस्मभ्यं पुरुवारं पुरुक्षुं रायस पोषं वि षयतां नाभिमस्मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāvasmabhyaṃ puruvāraṃ purukṣuṃ rāyas poṣaṃ vi ṣyatāṃ nābhimasme ||
Translation: May they disclose to us great store of treasure, much-longed for, rich in food, source of enjoyment.

Sanskit Text: विश्वान्यन्यो भुवना जजान विश्वमन्यो अभिचक्षाण एति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvānyanyo bhuvanā jajāna viśvamanyo abhicakṣāṇa eti |
Translation: 5 One of you Twain is Parent of all creatures, the other journeys onward all-beholding.

Sanskit Text: सोमापूषणाववतं धियं मे युवाभ्यां विश्वाः पर्तना जयेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somāpūṣaṇāvavataṃ dhiyaṃ me yuvābhyāṃ viśvāḥ pṛtanā jayema ||
Translation: Soma and Pūṣan, aid my thought with favour: with you may we o’ercome in all encounters.

Sanskit Text: धियं पूषा जिन्वतु विश्वमिन्वो रयिं सोमो रयिपतिर्दधातु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiyaṃ pūṣā jinvatu viśvaminvo rayiṃ somo rayipatirdadhātu |
Translation: 6 May Pūṣan stir our thought, the all-impelling, may Soma Lord of riches grant us riches.

Sanskit Text: अवतु देव्यदितिरनर्वा बर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avatu devyaditiranarvā bṛ... ||
Translation: May Aditi the perfect Goddess aid us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

Sanskit Text: वायो ये ते सहस्रिणो रथासस्तेभिरा गहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāyo ye te sahasriṇo rathāsastebhirā ghahi |
Translation: 1. O VĀYU, come to us with all the thousand chariots that are thine,

Sanskit Text: नियुत्वान सोमपीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niyutvān somapītaye ||
Translation: Team-borne, to drink the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: नियुत्वान वायवा गह्ययं शुक्रो अयामि ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: niyutvān vāyavā ghahyayaṃ śukro ayāmi te |
Translation: 2 Drawn by thy team, O Vāyu, come; to thee is offered this, the pure.

Sanskit Text: गन्तासि सुन्वतो गर्हम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghantāsi sunvato ghṛham ||
Translation: Thou visitest the presser's house.

Sanskit Text: शुक्रस्याद्य गवाशिर इन्द्रवायू नियुत्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śukrasyādya ghavāśira indravāyū niyutvataḥ |
Translation: 3 Indra and Vāyu, drawn by teams, ye Heroes, come today and drink.

Sanskit Text: आ यातं पिबतं नरा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yātaṃ pibataṃ narā ||
Translation: Of the bright juice when blent with milk.

Sanskit Text: अयं वां मित्रावरुणा सुतः सोम रताव्र्धा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā sutaḥ soma ṛtāvṛdhā |
Translation: 4 This Soma hath been shed for you, Law-strengtheners, Mitra-Varuṇa!

Sanskit Text: ममेदिह शरुतं हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mamediha śrutaṃ havam ||
Translation: Listen ye here to this my call.

Sanskit Text: राजानावनभिद्रुहा धरुवे सदस्युत्तमे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājānāvanabhidruhā dhruve sadasyuttame |
Translation: 5 Both Kings who never injure aught seat them in their supremest home,

Sanskit Text: सहस्रस्थूण आसाते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasrasthūṇa āsāte ||
Translation: The thousand-pillared, firmly-based.

Sanskit Text: ता सम्राजा घर्तासुती आदित्या दानुनस पती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā samrājā ghṛtāsutī ādityā dānunas patī |
Translation: 6 Fed with oblation, Sovran Kings, Ādityas, Lords of liberal gifts.

Sanskit Text: सचेते अनवह्वरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sacete anavahvaram ||
Translation: They wait on him whose life is true.

Sanskit Text: गोमदू षु नासत्याश्वावद यातमश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghomadū ṣu nāsatyāśvāvad yātamaśvinā |
Translation: 7 With kine, Nāsatyas, and with steeds, come, Aśvins, Rudras, to the house

Sanskit Text: वर्ती रुद्रा नर्पाय्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vartī rudrā nṛpāyyam ||
Translation: That will protect its heroes well;

Sanskit Text: न यत परो नान्तर आदधर्षद वर्षण्वसू |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yat paro nāntara ādadharṣad vṛṣaṇvasū |
Translation: 8 Such, wealthy Gods! as none afar nor standing nigh to us may harm,

Sanskit Text: दुःशंसो मर्त्यो रिपुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: duḥśaṃso martyo ripuḥ ||
Translation: Yea, no malicious mortal foe.

Sanskit Text: ता न आ वोळ्हमश्विना रयिं पिशङगसन्द्र्शम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā na ā voḷhamaśvinā rayiṃ piśaṅghasandṛśam |
Translation: 9 As such, O longed-far Aśvins, lead us on to wealth of varied sort,

Sanskit Text: धिष्न्यावरिवोविदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiṣnyāvarivovidam ||
Translation: Wealth that shall bring us room and rest.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो अङग महद भयमभी षदप चुच्यवत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro aṅgha mahad bhayamabhī ṣadapa cucyavat |
Translation: 10 Verily Indra, conquering all, driveth e’en mighty fear away,

Sanskit Text: स हि सथिरो विचर्षणिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi sthiro vicarṣaṇiḥ ||
Translation: For firm is he and swift to act.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रश्च मर्ळयाति नो न नः पश्चादघं नशत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraśca mṛḷayāti no na naḥ paścādaghaṃ naśat |
Translation: 11 Indra be gracious unto us: sin shall not reach us afterward,

Sanskit Text: भद्रं भवाति नः पुरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadraṃ bhavāti naḥ puraḥ ||
Translation: And good shall be before us still.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र आशाभ्यस परि सर्वाभ्यो अभयं करत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra āśābhyas pari sarvābhyo abhayaṃ karat |
Translation: 12 From all the regions of the world let Indra send security,

Sanskit Text: जेता शत्रून विचर्शणिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jetā śatrūn vicarśaṇiḥ ||
Translation: The foe-subduer, swift to act.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवास आ गत शर्णुता म इमं हवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devāsa ā ghata śṛṇutā ma imaṃ havam |
Translation: 13 O all ye Gods, come hitherward: hear this mine invocation, seat

Sanskit Text: एदं बर्हिर्नि षीदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: edaṃ barhirni ṣīdata ||
Translation: Yourselves upon this sacred grass.

Sanskit Text: तीव्रो वो मधुमानयं शुनहोत्रेषु मत्सरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tīvro vo madhumānayaṃ śunahotreṣu matsaraḥ |
Translation: 14 Among the Śunahotras strong for you is this sweet gladdening draught.

Sanskit Text: एतं पिबतकाम्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: etaṃ pibatakāmyam ||
Translation: Drink ye of this delightsome juice.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रज्येष्ठा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrajyeṣṭhā ... ||
Translation: 15 Ye

Sanskit Text: <a href="errata.htm#13">
Maruts
led by Indra, Gods with Pūṣan for your bounteousest,
अम्बितमे नदीतमे देवितमे सरस्वति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ambitame nadītame devitame sarasvati |
Translation: Hear all of you this call of mine.

Sanskit Text: अप्रशस्ता इव समसि परशस्तिमम्ब नस कर्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apraśastā iva smasi praśastimamba nas kṛdhi ||
Translation: 16 Best Mother, best of Rivers, best of Goddesses, Sarasvatī, We are, as ’twere, of no repute and dear Mother, give thou us renown.

Sanskit Text: तवे विश्वा सरस्वति शरितायूंषि देव्याम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve viśvā sarasvati śritāyūṃṣi devyām |
Translation: 17 In thee, Sarasvatī, divine, all generations have their stay.

Sanskit Text: शुनहोत्रेषु मत्स्व परजां देवि दिदिड्ढि नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śunahotreṣu matsva prajāṃ devi didiḍḍhi naḥ ||
Translation: Be, glad with Śunahotra's sons: O Goddess grant us progeny.

Sanskit Text: इमा बरह्म सरस्वति जुषस्व वाजिनीवति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā brahma sarasvati juṣasva vājinīvati |
Translation: 18 Enriched with sacrifice, accept Sarasvatī, these prayers of ours,

Sanskit Text: या ते मन्म गर्त्समदा रतावरि परिया देवेषु जुह्वति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā te manma ghṛtsamadā ṛtāvari priyā deveṣu juhvati ||
Translation: Thoughts which Gṛtsamadas beloved of Gods bring, Holy One, to thee.

Sanskit Text: परेतां यज्ञस्य शम्भुवा युवामिदा वर्णीमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pretāṃ yajñasya śambhuvā yuvāmidā vṛṇīmahe |
Translation: 19 Ye who bless sacrifice, go forth, for verily we choose you both,

Sanskit Text: अग्निंच हव्यवाहनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃca havyavāhanam ||
Translation: And Agni who conveys our gifts.

Sanskit Text: दयावा नः पर्थिवी इमं सिध्रमद्य दिविस्प्र्शम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyāvā naḥ pṛthivī imaṃ sidhramadya divispṛśam |
Translation: 20 This our effectual sacrifice, reaching the sky, shall Heaven and Earth

Sanskit Text: यज्णन्देवेषु यछताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajṇandeveṣu yachatām ||
Translation: Present unto the Gods to-day.

Sanskit Text: आ वामुपस्थमद्रुहा देवाः सीदन्तु यज्ञियाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāmupasthamadruhā devāḥ sīdantu yajñiyāḥ |
Translation: 21 In both your laps, ye guileless Ones, the Holy Gods shall sit them down

Sanskit Text: इहाद्यसोमपीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ihādyasomapītaye ||
Translation: To-day to drink the Soma here.

Sanskit Text: कनिक्रदज्जनुषं परब्रुवाण इयर्ति वाचमरितेव नावम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kanikradajjanuṣaṃ prabruvāṇa iyarti vācamariteva nāvam |
Translation: 1. TELLING his race aloud with cries repeated, he sends his voice out as his boat a steersman.

Sanskit Text: सुमङगलश्च शकुने भवासि मा तवा का चिदभिभा विश्व्या विदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sumaṅghalaśca śakune bhavāsi mā tvā kā cidabhibhā viśvyā vidat ||
Translation: O Bird, be ominous of happy fortune from no side may calamity befall thee.

Sanskit Text: मा तवा शयेन उद वधीन मा सुपर्णो मा तवा विददिषुमान्वीरो अस्ता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā tvā śyena ud vadhīn mā suparṇo mā tvā vidadiṣumānvīro astā |
Translation: 2 Let not the falcon kill thee, nor the eagle let not the arrow-bearing archer reach thee.

Sanskit Text: पित्र्यामनु परदिशं कनिक्रदत सुमङगलो भद्रवादी वदेह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pitryāmanu pradiśaṃ kanikradat sumaṅghalo bhadravādī vadeha ||
Translation: Still crying in the region of the Fathers, speak here auspicious, bearing joyful tidings.

Sanskit Text: अव करन्द दक्षिणतो गर्हाणां सुमङगलो भद्रवादी शकुन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava kranda dakṣiṇato ghṛhāṇāṃ sumaṅghalo bhadravādī śakunte |
Translation: 3 Bringing good tidings, Bird of happy omen, call thou out loudly southward of our dwellings,

Sanskit Text: मा न सतेन ईशत माघशंसो बर्हद ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā na stena īśata māghaśaṃso bṛhad ... ||
Translation: So that no thief, no sinner may oppress us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

Sanskit Text: सोमस्य मा तवसं वक्ष्यग्ने वह्निं चकर्थ विदथे यजध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somasya mā tavasaṃ vakṣyaghne vahniṃ cakartha vidathe yajadhyai |
Translation: 1. THOU, Agni, who wilt have the strong, hast made me the Soma's priest, to worship in assembly.

Sanskit Text: देवानछा दीद्यद युञ्जे अद्रिं शमाये अग्ने तन्वंजुषस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānachā dīdyad yuñje adriṃ śamāye aghne tanvaṃjuṣasva ||
Translation: Thou shinest to the Gods, I set the press-stones. I toil; be joyful in thyself, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: पराञ्चं यज्ञं चक्र्म वर्धतां गीः समिद्भिरग्निं नमसा दुवस्यन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāñcaṃ yajñaṃ cakṛma vardhatāṃ ghīḥ samidbhiraghniṃ namasā duvasyan |
Translation: 2 East have we turned the rite; may the hymn aid it. With wood and worship shall they honour Agni.

Sanskit Text: दिवः शशासुर्विदथा कवीनां गर्त्साय चित तवसे गातुमीषुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divaḥ śaśāsurvidathā kavīnāṃ ghṛtsāya cit tavase ghātumīṣuḥ ||
Translation: From heaven the synods of the wise have learnt it: e’en for the quick and strong they seek advancement.

Sanskit Text: मयो दधे मेधिरः पूतदक्षो दिवः सुबन्धुर्जनुषा पर्थिव्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mayo dadhe medhiraḥ pūtadakṣo divaḥ subandhurjanuṣā pṛthivyāḥ |
Translation: 3 The Prudent, he whose will is pure, brought welfare, allied by birth to Heaven and Earth in kinship.

Sanskit Text: अविन्दन्नु दर्शतमप्स्वन्तर्देवासो अग्निमपसि सवसॄणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avindannu darśatamapsvantardevāso aghnimapasi svasṝṇām ||
Translation: The Gods discovered in the midst of waters beautiful Agni with the Sisters' labour.

Sanskit Text: अवर्धयन सुभगं सप्त यह्वीः शवेतं जज्ञानमरुषम्महित्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avardhayan subhaghaṃ sapta yahvīḥ śvetaṃ jajñānamaruṣammahitvā |
Translation: 4 Him, Blessed One, the Seven strong Floods augmented, him white at birth and red when waxen mighty.

Sanskit Text: शिशुं न जातमभ्यारुरश्वा देवासो अग्निंजनिमन वपुष्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śiśuṃ na jātamabhyāruraśvā devāso aghniṃjaniman vapuṣyan ||
Translation: As mother mares run to their new-born you ling, so at his birth the Gods wondered at Agni.

Sanskit Text: शुक्रेभिरङगै रज आततन्वान करतुं पुनानः कविभिः पवित्रैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śukrebhiraṅghai raja ātatanvān kratuṃ punānaḥ kavibhiḥ pavitraiḥ |
Translation: 5 Spreading with radiant limbs throughout the region, purging his power with wise purifications,

Sanskit Text: शोचिर्वसानः पर्यायुरपां शरियो मिमीते बर्हतीरनूनाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śocirvasānaḥ paryāyurapāṃ śriyo mimīte bṛhatīranūnāḥ ||
Translation: Robing himself in light, the life of waters, he spreads abroad his high and perfect glories.

Sanskit Text: वव्राजा सीमनदतीरदब्धा दिवो यह्वीरवसाना अनग्नाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vavrājā sīmanadatīradabdhā divo yahvīravasānā anaghnāḥ |
Translation: 6 He sought heaven's Mighty Ones, the unconsuming, the unimpaired, not clothed and yet not naked.

Sanskit Text: सना अत्र युवतयः सयोनीरेकं गर्भं दधिरे सप्त वाणीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanā atra yuvatayaḥ sayonīrekaṃ gharbhaṃ dadhire sapta vāṇīḥ ||
Translation: Then they, ancient and young, who dwell together, Seven sounding Rivers, as one germ received him.

Sanskit Text: सतीर्णा अस्य संहतो विश्वरूपा घर्तस्य योनौ सरवथे मधूनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stīrṇā asya saṃhato viśvarūpā ghṛtasya yonau sravathe madhūnām |
Translation: 7 His piles, assuming every form, are scattered where flow sweet waters, at the spring of fatness;

Sanskit Text: अस्थुरत्र धेनवः पिन्वमाना मही दस्मस्य मातरा समीची ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asthuratra dhenavaḥ pinvamānā mahī dasmasya mātarā samīcī ||
Translation: There stood the milch-kine with full-laden udders, and both paired Mighty Mothers of the Wondrous.

Sanskit Text: बभ्राणः सूनो सहसो वयद्यौद दाधानः शुक्रा रभसा वपूंषि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: babhrāṇaḥ sūno sahaso vyadyaud dādhānaḥ śukrā rabhasā vapūṃṣi |
Translation: 8 Carefully cherished, Son of Strength, thou shoncst assuming lasting and refulgent beauties.

Sanskit Text: शचोतन्ति धारा मधुनो घर्तस्य वर्षा यत्र वाव्र्धे काव्येन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ścotanti dhārā madhuno ghṛtasya vṛṣā yatra vāvṛdhe kāvyena ||
Translation: Full streams of fatness and sweet juice descended, there where the Mighty One grew strong by wisdom.

Sanskit Text: पितुश्चिदूधर्जनुषा विवेद वयस्य धारा अस्र्जद वि धेनाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pituścidūdharjanuṣā viveda vyasya dhārā asṛjad vi dhenāḥ |
Translation: 9 From birth he knew even his Father's bosom, he set his voices and his streams in motion;

Sanskit Text: गुहा चरन्तं सखिभिः शिवेभिर्दिवो यह्वीभिर्नगुहा बभूव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghuhā carantaṃ sakhibhiḥ śivebhirdivo yahvībhirnaghuhā babhūva ||
Translation: Knew him who moved with blessed Friends in secret, with the young Dames of heaven. He stayed not hidden.

Sanskit Text: पितुश्च गर्भं जनितुश्च बभ्रे पूर्वीरेको अधयत पीप्यानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pituśca gharbhaṃ janituśca babhre pūrvīreko adhayat pīpyānāḥ |
Translation: 10 He nursed the Infant of the Sire and Maker: alone the Babe sucked many a teeming bosom.

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्णे सपत्नी शुचये सबन्धू उभे अस्मै मनुष्येनि पाहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṇe sapatnī śucaye sabandhū ubhe asmai manuṣyeni pāhi ||
Translation: Guard, for the Bright and Strong, the fellow-spouses friendly to men and bound to him in kinship.

Sanskit Text: उरौ महाननिबाधे ववर्धापो अग्निं यशसः सं हि पूर्वीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: urau mahānanibādhe vavardhāpo aghniṃ yaśasaḥ saṃ hi pūrvīḥ |
Translation: 11 The Mighty One increased in space unbounded; full many a glorious flood gave strength to Agni.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य योनावशयद दमूना जामीनामग्निरपसिस्वसॄणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya yonāvaśayad damūnā jāmīnāmaghnirapasisvasṝṇām ||
Translation: Friend of the house, within the lap of Order lay Agni, in the Sister Rivers' service.

Sanskit Text: अक्रो न बभ्रिः समिथे महीनां दिद्र्क्षेयः सूनवे भार्जीकः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: akro na babhriḥ samithe mahīnāṃ didṛkṣeyaḥ sūnave bhāṛjīkaḥ |
Translation: 12 As keen supporter where great waters gather, light-shedder whom the brood rejoice to look on;

Sanskit Text: उदुस्रिया जनिता यो जजानापां गर्भो नर्तमो यह्वो अग्निः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: udusriyā janitā yo jajānāpāṃ gharbho nṛtamo yahvo aghniḥ ||
Translation: He who begat, and will beget, the dawnlights, most manly, Child of Floods, is youthful Agni.

Sanskit Text: अपां गर्भं दर्शतमोषधीनां वना जजान सुभगा विरूपम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāṃ gharbhaṃ darśatamoṣadhīnāṃ vanā jajāna subhaghā virūpam |
Translation: 13 Him, varied in his form, the lovely Infant of floods and plants the blessed wood hath gendered.

Sanskit Text: देवासश्चिन मनसा सं हि जग्मुः पनिष्ठं जातं तवसं दुवस्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāsaścin manasā saṃ hi jaghmuḥ paniṣṭhaṃ jātaṃ tavasaṃ duvasyan ||
Translation: Gods even, moved in spirit, came around him, and served him at his birth, the Strong, the Wondrous.

Sanskit Text: बर्हन्त इद भानवो भार्जीकमग्निं सचन्त विद्युतो न शुक्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhanta id bhānavo bhāṛjīkamaghniṃ sacanta vidyuto na śukrāḥ |
Translation: 14 Like brilliant lightnings, mighty luminaries accompany the light-diffusing Agni,

Sanskit Text: गुहेव वर्द्धं सदसि सवे अन्तरपार ऊर्वे अम्र्तन्दुहानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghuheva vṛddhaṃ sadasi sve antarapāra ūrve amṛtanduhānāḥ ||
Translation: Waxen, as ’twere in secret, in his dwelling, while in the boundless stall they milk out Amṛta.

Sanskit Text: ईळे च तवा यजमानो हविर्भिरीळे सखित्वं सुमतिं निकामः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īḷe ca tvā yajamāno havirbhirīḷe sakhitvaṃ sumatiṃ nikāmaḥ |
Translation: 15 I sacrificing serve thee with oblations and crave with longing thy good-will and friendship.

Sanskit Text: देवैरवो मिमीहि सं जरित्रे रक्षा च नो दम्येभिरनीकैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devairavo mimīhi saṃ jaritre rakṣā ca no damyebhiranīkaiḥ ||
Translation: Grant, with the Gods, thy grace to him who lauds thee, protect us with thy rays that guard the homestead.

Sanskit Text: उपक्षेतारस्तव सुप्रणीते.अग्ने विश्वानि धन्या दधानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upakṣetārastava supraṇīte.aghne viśvāni dhanyā dadhānāḥ |
Translation: 16 May we, O Agni, thou who leadest wisely, thy followers and masters of all treasures,

Sanskit Text: सुरेतसा शरवसा तुञ्जमाना अभि षयाम पर्तनायून्रदेवान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suretasā śravasā tuñjamānā abhi ṣyāma pṛtanāyūnradevān ||
Translation: Strong in the glory of our noble offspring, subdue the godless when they seek the battle.

Sanskit Text: आ देवानामभवः केतुरग्ने मन्द्रो विश्वानि काव्यानि विद्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā devānāmabhavaḥ keturaghne mandro viśvāni kāvyāni vidvān |
Translation: 17 Ensign of Gods hast thou become, O Agni, joy-giver, knower of all secret wisdom.

Sanskit Text: परति मर्तानवासयो दमूना अनु देवान रथिरो यासिसाधन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati martānavāsayo damūnā anu devān rathiro yāsisādhan ||
Translation: Friend of the homestead, thou hast lightened mortals: carborne thou goest to the Gods, fulfilling.

Sanskit Text: नि दुरोणे अम्र्तो मर्त्यानां राजा ससाद विदथानि साधन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni duroṇe amṛto martyānāṃ rājā sasāda vidathāni sādhan |
Translation: 18 Within the house hath sate the King immortal of mortals, filling full their sacred synods.

Sanskit Text: घर्तप्रतीक उर्विया वयद्यौदग्निर्विश्वानि काव्यानि विद्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtapratīka urviyā vyadyaudaghnirviśvāni kāvyāni vidvān ||
Translation: Bedewed with holy oil he shineth widely, Agni, the knower of all secret wisdom.

Sanskit Text: आ नो गहि सख्येभिः शिवेभिर्महान महीभिरूतिभिः सरण्यन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no ghahi sakhyebhiḥ śivebhirmahān mahībhirūtibhiḥ saraṇyan |
Translation: 19 Come unto us with thine auspicious friendship, come speeding, Mighty, with thy mighty succours.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे रयिं बहुलं सन्तरुत्रं सुवाचं भागं यशसं कर्धी नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme rayiṃ bahulaṃ santarutraṃ suvācaṃ bhāghaṃ yaśasaṃ kṛdhī naḥ ||
Translation: Grant us abundant wealth that saves from danger, that brings a good repute, a glorious portion.

Sanskit Text: एता ते अग्ने जनिमा सनानि पर पूर्व्याय नूतनानि वोचम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etā te aghne janimā sanāni pra pūrvyāya nūtanāni vocam |
Translation: 20 To thee who art of old these songs, O Agni, have I declared, the ancient and the later.

Sanskit Text: महान्ति वर्ष्णे सवना कर्तेमा जन्मञ-जन्मन निहितो जातवेदाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahānti vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtemā janmañ-janman nihito jātavedāḥ ||
Translation: These great libations to the Strong are offiered: in every birth is Jātavedas stablished.

Sanskit Text: जन्मञ-जन्मन निहितो जातवेदा विश्वामित्रेभिरिध्यते अजस्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: janmañ-janman nihito jātavedā viśvāmitrebhiridhyate ajasraḥ |
Translation: 21 Stablished in every birth is Jātavedas, kindled perpetual by the Viśvāmitras.

Sanskit Text: तस्य वयं सुमतौ यज्ञियस्यापि भद्रे सौमनसे सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma ||
Translation: May we rest ever in the loving-kindness, in the auspicious grace of him the Holy.

Sanskit Text: इमं यज्ञं सहसावन तवं नो देवत्रा धेहि सुक्रतो रराणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ yajñaṃ sahasāvan tvaṃ no devatrā dhehi sukrato rarāṇaḥ |
Translation: 22 This sacrifice of ours do thou, O Mighty, O truly Wise, bear to the Gods rejoicing.

Sanskit Text: पर यंसि होतर्ब्र्हतीरिषो नो.अग्ने महि दरविनमा यजस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yaṃsi hotarbṛhatīriṣo no.aghne mahi dravinamā yajasva ||
Translation: Grant us abundant food, thou priestly Herald, vouchsafe to give us ample wealth, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: इळामग्ने पुरुदंसं सनिं गोः शश्वत्तमं हवमानायसाध |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iḷāmaghne purudaṃsaṃ saniṃ ghoḥ śaśvattamaṃ havamānāyasādha |
Translation: 23 As holy food, Agni, to thine'invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels.

Sanskit Text: सयान नः सूनुस्तनयो विजावाग्ने सा ते सुमतिर्भुत्वस्मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: syān naḥ sūnustanayo vijāvāghne sā te sumatirbhutvasme ||
Translation: To us he born a son, and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानराय धिषणां रताव्र्धे घर्तं न पूतमग्नयेजनामसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānarāya dhiṣaṇāṃ ṛtāvṛdhe ghṛtaṃ na pūtamaghnayejanāmasi |
Translation: 1. To him, Vaiśvānara, who strengthens Holy Law, to Agni we present our praise like oil made pure.

Sanskit Text: दविता होतारं मनुषश्च वाघतो धिया रथंन कुलिशः सं रण्वति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvitā hotāraṃ manuṣaśca vāghato dhiyā rathaṃna kuliśaḥ saṃ ṛṇvati ||
Translation: With thoughtful insight human priests bring him anear, our Herald from of old, as an axe forms a car.

Sanskit Text: स रोचयज्जनुषा रोदसी उभे स मात्रोरभवत पुत्र ईड्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa rocayajjanuṣā rodasī ubhe sa mātrorabhavat putra īḍyaḥ |
Translation: 2 He made the heaven and earth resplendent by his birth: Child of two Mothers he was meet to be implored,

Sanskit Text: हव्यवाळ अग्निरजरश्चनोहितो दूळभो विशामतिथिर्विभावसुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: havyavāḷ aghnirajaraścanohito dūḷabho viśāmatithirvibhāvasuḥ ||
Translation: Agni, oblation-bearer, gracious, ever-young, infallible, rich in radiant light, the guest of men.

Sanskit Text: करत्वा दक्षस्य तरुषो विधर्मणि देवासो अग्निं जनयन्त चित्तिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratvā dakṣasya taruṣo vidharmaṇi devāso aghniṃ janayanta cittibhiḥ |
Translation: 3 Within the range of their surpassinq power, by might, the Gods created Agni with inventive thought.

Sanskit Text: रुरुचानं भानुना जयोतिषा महामत्यं न वाजं सनिष्यन्नुप बरुवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rurucānaṃ bhānunā jyotiṣā mahāmatyaṃ na vājaṃ saniṣyannupa bruve ||
Translation: I, eager to win strength, address him, like a steed, resplendent with his brilliance, with his ample light.

Sanskit Text: आ मन्द्रस्य सनिष्यन्तो वरेण्यं वर्णीमहे अह्रयं वाजम्र्ग्मियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā mandrasya saniṣyanto vareṇyaṃ vṛṇīmahe ahrayaṃ vājamṛghmiyam |
Translation: 4 Eager to gain, we crave from him the friendly God strength confident, choiceworthy meet to be extolled:

Sanskit Text: रातिं भर्गूणामुशिजं कविक्रतुमग्निं राजन्तं दिव्येन शोचिषा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rātiṃ bhṛghūṇāmuśijaṃ kavikratumaghniṃ rājantaṃ divyena śociṣā ||
Translation: The Bhṛgus' bounty, willing, strong with sages' lore, even Agni shining forth with light that comes from heaven.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं सुम्नाय दधिरे पुरो जना वाजश्रवसमिह वर्क्तबर्हिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ sumnāya dadhire puro janā vājaśravasamiha vṛktabarhiṣaḥ |
Translation: 5 For happiness, men, having trimmed the sacred grass, set Agni glorious for his strength before them here;

Sanskit Text: यतस्रुचः सुरुचं विश्वदेव्यं रुद्रं यज्ञानांसाधदिष्टिमपसाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatasrucaḥ surucaṃ viśvadevyaṃ rudraṃ yajñānāṃsādhadiṣṭimapasām ||
Translation: Yea, with raised ladles, him bright, dear to all the Gods, perfecting aims of works, Rudra of solemn rites.

Sanskit Text: पावकशोचे तव हि कषयं परि होतर्यज्ञेषु वर्क्तबर्हिषो नरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāvakaśoce tava hi kṣayaṃ pari hotaryajñeṣu vṛktabarhiṣo naraḥ |
Translation: 6 Around thy dwelling-place, O brightly-shining Priest, are men at sacrifice, whose sacred grass is trimmed.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने दुव इछमानास आप्यमुपासते दरविणं धेहि तेभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne duva ichamānāsa āpyamupāsate draviṇaṃ dhehi tebhyaḥ ||
Translation: Wishing to do thee service, Agni, they are there, desirous of thy friendship grant them store of wealth.

Sanskit Text: आ रोदसी अप्र्णदा सवर्महज्जातं यदेनमपसो अधारयन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā rodasī apṛṇadā svarmahajjātaṃ yadenamapaso adhārayan |
Translation: 7 He hath filled heaven and earth and the great realm of light, when at his birth the skilful held him in their hold.

Sanskit Text: सो अध्वराय परि णीयते कविरत्यो न वाजसातयेचनोहितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: so adhvarāya pari ṇīyate kaviratyo na vājasātayecanohitaḥ ||
Translation: He like a horse is led forth to the sacrifice Sage, graciously inclined, that he may win us strength.

Sanskit Text: नमस्यत हव्यदातिं सवध्वरं दुवस्यत दम्यं जातवेदसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: namasyata havyadātiṃ svadhvaraṃ duvasyata damyaṃ jātavedasam |
Translation: 8 Honour the oblation-bearer, him who knows fair rites, serve ye the Household Friend who knows all things that be.

Sanskit Text: रथीर्र्तस्य बर्हतो विचर्षणिरग्निर्देवानामभवत पुरोहितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathīrṛtasya bṛhato vicarṣaṇiraghnirdevānāmabhavat purohitaḥ ||
Translation: He drives the chariot of the lofty ordinance: Agni most active, is the great High Priest of Gods.

Sanskit Text: तिस्रो यह्वस्य समिधः परिज्मनो.अग्नेरपुनन्नुशिजो अम्र्त्यवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisro yahvasya samidhaḥ parijmano.aghnerapunannuśijo amṛtyavaḥ |
Translation: 9 They who are free from death, fain for him, purified three splendours of the mighty Agni, circling all.

Sanskit Text: तासामेकामदधुर्मर्त्ये भुजमु लोकमु दवे उप जामिमीयतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāsāmekāmadadhurmartye bhujamu lokamu dve upa jāmimīyatuḥ ||
Translation: To man, for his enjoyment, one of these they gave: the other two have passed into the sister sphere.

Sanskit Text: विशां कविं विश्पतिं मानुषीरिषः सं सीमक्र्ण्वन सवधितिं न तेजसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśāṃ kaviṃ viśpatiṃ mānuṣīriṣaḥ saṃ sīmakṛṇvan svadhitiṃ na tejase |
Translation: 10 Man's sacrificial food hath sharpened like an axe, for brightness, him the Sage of men, the people's Lord,

Sanskit Text: स उद्वतो निवतो याति वेविषत स गर्भमेषु भुवनेषु दीधरत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa udvato nivato yāti veviṣat sa gharbhameṣu bhuvaneṣu dīdharat ||
Translation: Busied with sacred rites he mounts and he descends. He hath laid down his vital germ within these worlds.

Sanskit Text: स जिन्वते जठरेषु परजज्ञिवान वर्षा चित्रेषु नानदन न सिंहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa jinvate jaṭhareṣu prajajñivān vṛṣā citreṣu nānadan na siṃhaḥ |
Translation: 11 He stirs with life in wombs dissimilar in kind, born as a Lion or a loudly-bellowing Bull:

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानरः पर्थुपाजा अमर्त्यो वसु रत्ना दयमानो वि दाशुषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānaraḥ pṛthupājā amartyo vasu ratnā dayamāno vi dāśuṣe ||
Translation: Vaiśvānara immortal with wide-reaching might, bestowing goods and wealth on him who offiers gifts.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानरः परत्नथा नाकमारुहद दिवस पर्ष्ठं भन्दमानः सुमन्मभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānaraḥ pratnathā nākamāruhad divas pṛṣṭhaṃ bhandamānaḥ sumanmabhiḥ |
Translation: 12 Vaiśvānara, as of old, mounted the cope of heaven, heaven's ridge, well greeted, by those skilled in noble songs.

Sanskit Text: स पूर्ववज्जनयञ जन्तवे धनं समानमज्मं पर्येति जाग्र्विः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pūrvavajjanayañ jantave dhanaṃ samānamajmaṃ paryeti jāghṛviḥ ||
Translation: He, as of old, producing riches for the folk, still watchful, traversesthe common way again.

Sanskit Text: रतावानं यज्ञियं विप्रमुक्थ्यमा यं दधे मातरिश्वा दिवि कषयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtāvānaṃ yajñiyaṃ vipramukthyamā yaṃ dadhe mātariśvā divi kṣayam |
Translation: 13 For new prosperity we seek to Agni, him whose course is splendid, gold-haired, excellently bright,

Sanskit Text: तं चित्रयामं हरिकेशमीमहे सुदीतिमग्निं सुविताय नव्यसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ citrayāmaṃ harikeśamīmahe sudītimaghniṃ suvitāya navyase ||
Translation: Whom Mātariśvan stablished, dweller in the heaven, meet for high praise and holy, sage and true to Law.

Sanskit Text: शुचिं न यामन्निषिरं सवर्द्र्शं केतुं दिवो रोचनस्थामुषर्बुधम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuciṃ na yāmanniṣiraṃ svardṛśaṃ ketuṃ divo rocanasthāmuṣarbudham |
Translation: 14 As pure and swift of course, beholder of the light, who stands in heaven's bright sphere a sign, who wakes at dawn,

Sanskit Text: अग्निं मूर्धानं दिवो अप्रतिष्कुतं तमीमहे नमसा वाजिनं बर्हत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ mūrdhānaṃ divo apratiṣkutaṃ tamīmahe namasā vājinaṃ bṛhat ||
Translation: Agni, the head of heaven, whom none may turn aside-to him the Powerful with mighty prayer we seek.

Sanskit Text: मन्द्रं होतारं शुचिमद्वयाविनं दमूनसमुक्थ्यं विश्वचर्षणिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mandraṃ hotāraṃ śucimadvayāvinaṃ damūnasamukthyaṃ viśvacarṣaṇim |
Translation: 15 The cheerful Priest, the pure, in whom no guile is found, Friend of the House, praise-worthy, dear to all mankind,

Sanskit Text: रथं न चित्रं वपुषाय दर्शतं मनुर्हितं सदमिद राय ईमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathaṃ na citraṃ vapuṣāya darśataṃ manurhitaṃ sadamid rāya īmahe ||
Translation: Fair to behold for beauty like a splendid car,—Agni the Friend of men we ever seek for wealth.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानराय पर्थुपाजसे विपो रत्ना विधन्त धरुणेषु गातवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānarāya pṛthupājase vipo ratnā vidhanta dharuṇeṣu ghātave |
Translation: 1. To him who shines afar, Vaiśvānara, shall bards give precious things that he may go on certain paths:

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्हि देवानम्र्तो दुवस्यत्यथा धर्माणि सनता न दूदुषत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirhi devānamṛto duvasyatyathā dharmāṇi sanatā na dūduṣat ||
Translation: For Agni the Immortal serves the Deities, and therefore never breaks their everlasting laws.

Sanskit Text: अन्तर्दूतो रोदसी दस्म ईयते होता निषत्तो मनुषः पुरोहितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: antardūto rodasī dasma īyate hotā niṣatto manuṣaḥ purohitaḥ |
Translation: 2 He, wondrous envoy, goes between the earth and heaven, firm seated as the Herald, great High Priest of men.

Sanskit Text: कषयं बर्हन्तं परि भूषति दयुभिर्देवेभिरग्निरिषितो धियावसुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣayaṃ bṛhantaṃ pari bhūṣati dyubhirdevebhiraghniriṣito dhiyāvasuḥ ||
Translation: He compassethwith rays the lofty dwelling-place, Agni, sent forward by the Gods, enriched with piayer.

Sanskit Text: केतुं यज्ञानां विदथस्य सा धनं विप्रासो अग्निं महयन्त चित्तिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ketuṃ yajñānāṃ vidathasya sā dhanaṃ viprāso aghniṃ mahayanta cittibhiḥ |
Translation: 3 Sages shall glorify Agni with earnest thoughts, ensign of sacrifice, who fills the synod full:

Sanskit Text: अपांसि यस्मिन्नधि सन्दधुर्गिरस्तस्मिन सुम्नानि यजमान आ चके ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāṃsi yasminnadhi sandadhurghirastasmin sumnāni yajamāna ā cake ||
Translation: In whom the singers have stored up their holy acts to him the worshipper looks for joy and happiness.

Sanskit Text: पिता यज्ञानामसुरो विपश्चितां विमानमग्निर्वयुनं च वाघताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pitā yajñānāmasuro vipaścitāṃ vimānamaghnirvayunaṃ ca vāghatām |
Translation: 4 The Sire of sacrifice, great God of holy bards, Agni, the measure and the symbol of the priests,

Sanskit Text: आ विवेश रोदसी भूरिवर्पसा पुरुप्रियो भन्दते धामभिः कविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā viveśa rodasī bhūrivarpasā purupriyo bhandate dhāmabhiḥ kaviḥ ||
Translation: Hath entered heaven and earth that show in varied form: the Sage whom many love rejoiceth in his might.

Sanskit Text: चन्द्रमग्निं चन्द्ररथं हरिव्रतं वैश्वानरमप्सुषदं सवर्विदम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: candramaghniṃ candrarathaṃ harivrataṃ vaiśvānaramapsuṣadaṃ svarvidam |
Translation: 5 Bright Agni with the bright car, Lord of green domains, Vaiśvānara dweller in the floods, who finds the light,

Sanskit Text: विगाहं तूर्णिं तविषीभिराव्र्तं भूर्णिं देवास इह सुश्रियं दधुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vighāhaṃ tūrṇiṃ taviṣībhirāvṛtaṃ bhūrṇiṃ devāsa iha suśriyaṃ dadhuḥ ||
Translation: Pervading, swift and wild, encompassed round with powers, him very glorious have the Gods established here.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्देवेभिर्मनुषश्च जन्तुभिस्तन्वानो यज्ञं पुरुपेशसं धिया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirdevebhirmanuṣaśca jantubhistanvāno yajñaṃ purupeśasaṃ dhiyā |
Translation: 6 Agni, together with the Gods and Manu's folk by thought extending sacrifice in varied form,

Sanskit Text: रथीरन्तरीयते साधदिष्टिभिर्जीरो दमूना अभिशस्तिचातनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathīrantarīyate sādhadiṣṭibhirjīro damūnā abhiśasticātanaḥ ||
Translation: Goes, car-borne, to and fro with those who crown each rite, the fleet, the Household Friend, who turns the curse aside.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने जरस्व सवपत्य आयुन्यूर्जा पिन्वस्व समिषो दिदीहि नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne jarasva svapatya āyunyūrjā pinvasva samiṣo didīhi naḥ |
Translation: 7 Sing, Agni, for long life to us and noble sons: teem thou with plenty, shine upon us store of food.

Sanskit Text: वयांसि जिन्व बर्हतश्च जाग्र्व उशिग देवानामसि सुक्रतुर्विपाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayāṃsi jinva bṛhataśca jāghṛva uśigh devānāmasi sukraturvipām ||
Translation: Increase the great man's strength, thou ever-vigilant: thou, longing for the Gods, knowest their hymns full well.

Sanskit Text: विश्पतिं यह्वमतिथिं नरः सदा यन्तारं धीनामुशिजं च वाघताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśpatiṃ yahvamatithiṃ naraḥ sadā yantāraṃ dhīnāmuśijaṃ ca vāghatām |
Translation: 8 The Mighty One, Lord of the people and their guest, the leader of their thoughts, devoted Friend of priests,

Sanskit Text: अध्वराणां चेतनं जातवेदसं पर शंसन्ति नमसा जूतिभिर्व्र्धे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhvarāṇāṃ cetanaṃ jātavedasaṃ pra śaṃsanti namasā jūtibhirvṛdhe ||
Translation: Our solemn rites' announcer, Jātavedas, men with worship ever praise, with urgings for their weal.

Sanskit Text: विभावा देवः सुरणः परि कषितीरग्निर्बभूव शवसासुमद्रथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vibhāvā devaḥ suraṇaḥ pari kṣitīraghnirbabhūva śavasāsumadrathaḥ |
Translation: 9 Agni the God resplendent, giver of great joy, hath on his lovely car compassed the lands with, might.

Sanskit Text: तस्य वरतानि भूरिपोषिणो वयमुप भूषेमदम आ सुव्र्क्तिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya vratāni bhūripoṣiṇo vayamupa bhūṣemadama ā suvṛktibhiḥ ||
Translation: Let us with pure laudations in his house approach the high laws of the nourisher of multitudes.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानर तव धामान्या चके येभिः सवर्विदभवो विचक्षण |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānara tava dhāmānyā cake yebhiḥ svarvidabhavo vicakṣaṇa |
Translation: 10 I celebrate thy glories, O Vaiśvānara, wherewith thou, O farsighted God, has found the light.

Sanskit Text: जात आप्र्णो भुवनानि रोदसी अग्ने ता विस्वा परिभूरसि तमना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jāta āpṛṇo bhuvanāni rodasī aghne tā visvā paribhūrasi tmanā ||
Translation: Thou filledst at thy birth both worlds, the earth and heaven: all this, O Agni, hast thou compassed of thyself.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानरस्य दंसनाभ्यो बर्हदरिणादेकः सवपस्यया कविः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānarasya daṃsanābhyo bṛhadariṇādekaḥ svapasyayā kaviḥ |
Translation: 11 By his great skill the Sage alone hath brought to pass a great deed, mightier than Vaiśvānara's wondrous acts.

Sanskit Text: उभा पितरा महयन्नजायताग्निर्द्यावाप्र्थिवी भूरिरेतसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhā pitarā mahayannajāyatāghnirdyāvāpṛthivī bhūriretasā ||
Translation: Agni sprang into being, magnifying both his Parents, Heaven and Earth, rich in prolific seed.

Sanskit Text: समित-समित सुमना बोध्यस्मे शुचा-शुचा सुमतिं रासि वस्वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samit-samit sumanā bodhyasme śucā-śucā sumatiṃ rāsi vasvaḥ |
Translation: 1. BE friendly with each kindled log of fuel, with every flash bestow the boon of riches.

Sanskit Text: आ देव देवान यजथाय वक्षि सखा सखीन सुमना यक्ष्यग्ने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā deva devān yajathāya vakṣi sakhā sakhīn sumanā yakṣyaghne ||
Translation: Bring thou the Gods, O God, unto our worship: serve, well-inclined, as Friend thy friends, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: यं देवासस्त्रिरहन्नायजन्ते दिवे-दिवे वरुणो मित्रो अग्निः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ devāsastrirahannāyajante dive-dive varuṇo mitro aghniḥ |
Translation: 2 Agni whom daily Varuṇa and Mitra the Gods bring thrice a day to this our worship,

Sanskit Text: सेमं यज्ञं मधुमन्तं कर्धी नस्तनूनपाद घर्तयोनिं विधन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: semaṃ yajñaṃ madhumantaṃ kṛdhī nastanūnapād ghṛtayoniṃ vidhantam ||
Translation: Tanūnapāt, enrich with meath our service that dwells with holy oil, that offers honour.

Sanskit Text: पर दीधितिर्विश्ववारा जिगाति होतारमिळः परथमं यजध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra dīdhitirviśvavārā jighāti hotāramiḷaḥ prathamaṃ yajadhyai |
Translation: 3 The thought that bringeth every boon proceedeth to worship first the Priest of the libation,

Sanskit Text: अछा नमोभिर्व्र्षभं वन्दध्यै स देवान यक्षदिषितो यजीयान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā namobhirvṛṣabhaṃ vandadhyai sa devān yakṣadiṣito yajīyān ||
Translation: That we may greet the Strong One with our homage. Urged, may he bring the Gods, best Sacrificer.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वो वां गातुरध्वरे अकार्यूर्ध्वा शोचींषि परस्थिता रजांसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvo vāṃ ghāturadhvare akāryūrdhvā śocīṃṣi prasthitā rajāṃsi |
Translation: 4 On high your way to sacrifice was made ready; the radiant flames went upward to the regions.

Sanskit Text: दिवो वा नाभा नयसादि होता सत्र्णीमहि देवव्यचा वि बर्हिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo vā nābhā nyasādi hotā stṛṇīmahi devavyacā vi barhiḥ ||
Translation: Full in the midst of heaven the Priest is seated: sirew we the sacred grass where Gods may rest them.

Sanskit Text: सप्त होत्राणि मनसा वर्णाना इन्वन्तो विश्वं परति यन्न्र्तेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sapta hotrāṇi manasā vṛṇānā invanto viśvaṃ prati yannṛtena |
Translation: 5 Claiming in mind the seven priests' burntoblations, inciting all, they came in settled order.

Sanskit Text: नर्पेशसो विदथेषु पर जाता अभीमं यज्ञं वि चरन्त पूर्वीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛpeśaso vidatheṣu pra jātā abhīmaṃ yajñaṃ vi caranta pūrvīḥ ||
Translation: To this our sacrifice approach the many who show in hero beauty at assemblies.

Sanskit Text: आ भन्दमाने उषसा उपाके उत समयेते तन्वा विरूपे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā bhandamāne uṣasā upāke uta smayete tanvā virūpe |
Translation: 6 Night and Dawn, lauded, hither come together, both smiling, different are their forms in colour,

Sanskit Text: यथा नो मित्रो वरुणो जुजोषदिन्द्रो मरुत्वानुत वा महोभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā no mitro varuṇo jujoṣadindro marutvānuta vā mahobhiḥ ||
Translation: That Varuṇa and Mitra may accept us, and Indra, girt by Maruts, with his glories.

Sanskit Text: दैव्या होतारा परथमा नय रञ्जे सप्त पर्क्षासः सवधयामदन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: daivyā hotārā prathamā ny ṛñje sapta pṛkṣāsaḥ svadhayāmadanti |
Translation: 7. I crave the grace of heaven's two chief Invokers: the seven swift steeds joy in their wonted manner.

Sanskit Text: रतं शंसन्त रतमित त आहुरनु वरतं वरतपा दीध्यानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtaṃ śaṃsanta ṛtamit ta āhuranu vrataṃ vratapā dīdhyānāḥ ||
Translation: These speak of truth, praising the truth eternal, thinking on Order as the guards of Order.

Sanskit Text: आ भारती भारतीभिः सजोषा इळा देवैर्मनुष्येभिरग्निः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā bhāratī bhāratībhiḥ sajoṣā iḷā devairmanuṣyebhiraghniḥ |
Translation: 8 May Bhāratī with all her Sisters, Iḷā accordant with the Gods, with mortalls Agni,

Sanskit Text: सरस्वती सारस्वतेभिरर्वाक तिस्रो देवीर्बर्हिरेदं सदन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarasvatī sārasvatebhirarvāk tisro devīrbarhiredaṃ sadantu ||
Translation: Sarasvatī with all her kindred Rivers, come to this grass, Three Goddesses, and seat them.

Sanskit Text: तन नस्तुरीपमध पोषयित्नु देव तवष्टर्वि रराणः सयस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan nasturīpamadha poṣayitnu deva tvaṣṭarvi rarāṇaḥ syasva |
Translation: 9 Well pleased with us do thou O God, O Tvaṣṭar, give ready issue to our procreant vigour,

Sanskit Text: यतो वीरः कर्मण्यः सुदक्षो युक्तग्रावा जायते देवकामः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yato vīraḥ karmaṇyaḥ sudakṣo yuktaghrāvā jāyate devakāmaḥ ||
Translation: Whence springs the hero, powerful, skilled in action, lover of Gods, adjuster of the press-stones.

Sanskit Text: वनस्पते.अव सर्जोप देवानग्निर्हविः शमिता सूदयाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanaspate.ava sṛjopa devānaghnirhaviḥ śamitā sūdayāti |
Translation: 10 Send to the Gods the oblation, Lord of Forests; and let the Immolator, Agni, dress it.

Sanskit Text: सेदु होता सत्यतरो यजाति यथा देवानां जनिमानि वेद ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sedu hotā satyataro yajāti yathā devānāṃ janimāni veda ||
Translation: He as the truer Priest shall offer worship, for the Gods’ generations well he knoweth.

Sanskit Text: आ याह्यग्ने समिधानो अर्वां इन्द्रेण देवैः सरथं तुरेभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yāhyaghne samidhāno arvāṃ indreṇa devaiḥ sarathaṃ turebhiḥ |
Translation: 11 Come thou to us, O Agni, duly kindled, together with the potent Gods and Indra.

Sanskit Text: बर्हिर्न आस्तामदितिः सुपुत्रा सवाहा देवा अम्र्तामादयन्ताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: barhirna āstāmaditiḥ suputrā svāhā devā amṛtāmādayantām ||
Translation: On this our grass sit Aditi, happy Mother, and let our Hail delight the Gods Immortal.

Sanskit Text: अञ्जन्ति तवामध्वरे देवयन्तो वनस्पते मधुना दैव्येन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: añjanti tvāmadhvare devayanto vanaspate madhunā daivyena |
Translation: 1. GOD-SERVING men, O Sovran of the Forest, with heavenly meath at sacrifice anoint thee.

Sanskit Text: यदूर्ध्वस्तिष्ठा दरविणेह धत्ताद यद वा कषयो मातुरस्या उपस्थे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadūrdhvastiṣṭhā draviṇeha dhattād yad vā kṣayo māturasyā upasthe ||
Translation: Grant wealth to us when thou art standing upright as when reposing on this Mother's bosom.

Sanskit Text: समिद्धस्य शरयमाणः पुरस्ताद बरह्म वन्वानो अजरं सुवीरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samiddhasya śrayamāṇaḥ purastād brahma vanvāno ajaraṃ suvīram |
Translation: 2 Set up to eastward of the fire enkindled, accepting prayer that wastes not, rich in hero.

Sanskit Text: आरे अस्मदमतिं बाधमान उच्छ्रयस्व महते सौभगाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āre asmadamatiṃ bādhamāna ucchrayasva mahate saubhaghāya ||
Translation: Driving far from us poverty and famine, lift thyself up to bring us great good fortune.

Sanskit Text: उच्छ्रयस्व वनस्पते वर्ष्मन पर्थिव्या अधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ucchrayasva vanaspate varṣman pṛthivyā adhi |
Translation: 3 Lord of the Forest, raise. thyself up on the loftiest spot of earth.

Sanskit Text: सुमिती मीयमानो वर्चो धा यज्ञवाहसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sumitī mīyamāno varco dhā yajñavāhase ||
Translation: Give splendour, fixt and measured well, to him who brings the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: युवा सुवासाः परिवीत आगात स उ शरेयान भवति जायमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvā suvāsāḥ parivīta āghāt sa u śreyān bhavati jāyamānaḥ |
Translation: 4 Well-robed, enveloped he is come, the youthful: springing to life his glory waxeth greater.

Sanskit Text: तं धीरासः कवय उन नयन्ति सवाध्यो मनसा देवयन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ dhīrāsaḥ kavaya un nayanti svādhyo manasā devayantaḥ ||
Translation: Contemplative in mind and God-adoring, sages of high intelligence upraise him.

Sanskit Text: जातो जायते सुदिनत्वे अह्नां समर्य आ विदथे वर्धमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jāto jāyate sudinatve ahnāṃ samarya ā vidathe vardhamānaḥ |
Translation: 5 Sprung up he rises in the days' fair weather, increasing in the men-frequented synod.

Sanskit Text: पुनन्ति धीरा अपसो मनीषा देवया विप्र उदियर्ति वाचम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punanti dhīrā apaso manīṣā devayā vipra udiyarti vācam ||
Translation: With song the wise and skilful consecrate him: his voice the God-adoring singer utters.

Sanskit Text: यान वो नरो देवयन्तो निमिम्युर्वनस्पते सवधितिर्वा ततक्ष |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yān vo naro devayanto nimimyurvanaspate svadhitirvā tatakṣa |
Translation: 6, Ye whom religious men have firmly planted; thou Forest Sovran whom the axe hath fashioned,—

Sanskit Text: ते देवासः सवरवस्तस्थिवांसः परजावदस्मे दिधिषन्तु रत्नम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te devāsaḥ svaravastasthivāṃsaḥ prajāvadasme didhiṣantu ratnam ||
Translation: Let those the Stakes divine which here are standing be fain to grant us wealth with store of children.

Sanskit Text: ये वर्क्णासो अधि कषमि निमितासो यतस्रुचः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye vṛkṇāso adhi kṣami nimitāso yatasrucaḥ |
Translation: 7 O men who lift the ladles up, these hewn and planted in the ground,

Sanskit Text: ते नो वयन्तु वार्यं देवत्रा कषेत्रसाधसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te no vyantu vāryaṃ devatrā kṣetrasādhasaḥ ||
Translation: Bringing a blessing to the field, shall bear our precious gift to Gods.

Sanskit Text: आदित्या रुद्रा वसवः सुनीथा दयावाक्षामा पर्थिवी अन्तरिक्षम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityā rudrā vasavaḥ sunīthā dyāvākṣāmā pṛthivī antarikṣam |
Translation: 8 Ādityas, Rudras, Vasus, careful leaders, Earth, Heaven, and Prthivi and Air's mid-region,

Sanskit Text: सजोषसो यज्ञमवन्तु देवा ऊर्ध्वं कर्ण्वन्त्वध्वरस्य केतुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣaso yajñamavantu devā ūrdhvaṃ kṛṇvantvadhvarasya ketum ||
Translation: Accordant Deities shall bless our worship and make our sacrifice's ensign lofty.

Sanskit Text: हंसा इव शरेणिशो यतानाः शुक्रा वसानाः सवरवो नागुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: haṃsā iva śreṇiśo yatānāḥ śukrā vasānāḥ svaravo naāghuḥ |
Translation: 9 Like swan's that flee in lengthened line, the Pillars have come to us arrayed in brilliant coIour.

Sanskit Text: उन्नीयमानाः कविभिः पुरस्ताद देवा देवानामपि यन्ति पाथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: unnīyamānāḥ kavibhiḥ purastād devā devānāmapi yanti pāthaḥ ||
Translation: They, lifted up on high, by sages, eastward, go forth as Gods to the God's dwelling-places.

Sanskit Text: शर्ङगाणीवेच्छ्र्ङगिणां सं दद्र्श्रे चषालवन्तः सवरवः पर्थिव्याम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṅghāṇīvecchṛṅghiṇāṃ saṃ dadṛśre caṣālavantaḥ svaravaḥ pṛthivyām |
Translation: 10 Those Stakes upon the earth with rings that deck them seem to the eye like horns of horned creatures;

Sanskit Text: वाघद्भिर्वा विहवे शरोषमाणा अस्मानवन्तु पर्तनाज्येषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāghadbhirvā vihave śroṣamāṇā asmānavantu pṛtanājyeṣu ||
Translation: Or, as upraised by priests in invocation, let them assist us in the rush to battle.

Sanskit Text: वनस्पते शतवल्शो वि रोह सहस्रवल्शा वि वयं रुहेम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanaspate śatavalśo vi roha sahasravalśā vi vayaṃ ruhema |
