Translation: 11 Lord of the Wood, rise with a hundred branches. with thousand branches may we rise to greatness,

Sanskit Text: यं तवामयं सवधितिस्तेजमानः परणिनाय महते सौभगाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ tvāmayaṃ svadhitistejamānaḥ praṇināya mahate saubhaghāya ||
Translation: Tlou whom this hatchct, with an edge well whetted for great felicity, hath brought before us.

Sanskit Text: तवामग्ने मनीषिणः सम्राजं चर्षणीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmaghne manīṣiṇaḥ samrājaṃ carṣaṇīnām |
Translation: 1. THEE Agni, God, Imperial Lord of all mankind, do mortal men

Sanskit Text: देवं मर्तास इन्धते समध्वरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devaṃ martāsa indhate samadhvare ||
Translation: With understanding kindle at the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: तवां यज्ञेष्व रत्विजमग्ने होतारमीळते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ yajñeṣv ṛtvijamaghne hotāramīḷate |
Translation: 2 They laud thee in their solemn rites, Agni, as Minister and Priest,

Sanskit Text: गोपा रतस्य दीदिहि सवे दमे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghopā ṛtasya dīdihi sve dame ||
Translation: Shine forth in thine own home as guardian of the Law.

Sanskit Text: स घा यस्ते ददाशति समिधा जातवेदसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ghā yaste dadāśati samidhā jātavedase |
Translation: 3 He, verily, who honours thee with fuel, Knower of all life,

Sanskit Text: सो अग्ने धत्तेसुवीर्यं स पुष्यति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: so aghne dhattesuvīryaṃ sa puṣyati ||
Translation: He, Agni! wins heroic might, he prospers well.

Sanskit Text: स केतुरध्वराणामग्निर्देवेभिरा गमत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa keturadhvarāṇāmaghnirdevebhirā ghamat |
Translation: 4 Ensign of sacrifices, he, Agni, with Gods is come to us,

Sanskit Text: अञ्जानः सप्त होत्र्भिर्हविष्मते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: añjānaḥ sapta hotṛbhirhaviṣmate ||
Translation: Decked by the seven priests, to him who bringeth gifts.

Sanskit Text: पर होत्रे पूर्व्यं वचो.अग्नये भरता बर्हत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra hotre pūrvyaṃ vaco.aghnaye bharatā bṛhat |
Translation: 5 To Agni, the Invoking Priest, offer your best, your lofty speech,

Sanskit Text: विपां जयोतींषि बिभ्रते न वेधसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vipāṃ jyotīṃṣi bibhrate na vedhase ||
Translation: To him Ordainer-like who brings the light of songs.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं वर्धन्तु नो गिरो यतो जायत उक्थ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ vardhantu no ghiro yato jāyata ukthyaḥ |
Translation: 6 Let these our hymns make Agni grow, whence, meet for laud, he springs to life,

Sanskit Text: महे वाजायद्रविणाय दर्शतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahe vājāyadraviṇāya darśataḥ ||
Translation: To mighty strength and great possession, fair to see.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने यजिष्ठो अध्वरे देवान देवयते यज |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne yajiṣṭho adhvare devān devayate yaja |
Translation: 7 Best Sacrificer, bring the Gods, O Agni, to the pious man:

Sanskit Text: होता मन्द्रो विराजस्यति सरिधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotā mandro virājasyati sridhaḥ ||
Translation: A joyful Priest, thy splendour drive our foes afar

Sanskit Text: स नः पावक दीदिहि दयुमदस्मे सुवीर्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ pāvaka dīdihi dyumadasme suvīryam |
Translation: 8 As such, O Purifier, shine on us heroic glorious might:

Sanskit Text: भवा सतोत्र्भ्योन्तमः सवस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhavā stotṛbhyoantamaḥ svastaye ||
Translation: Be nearest Friend to those who laud thee, for their weal.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा विप्रा विपन्यवो जाग्र्वांसः समिन्धते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā viprā vipanyavo jāghṛvāṃsaḥ samindhate |
Translation: 9 So, wakeful, versed in sacred hymns, the holy singers kindly thee.

Sanskit Text: हव्यवाहममर्त्यं सहोव्र्धम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: havyavāhamamartyaṃ sahovṛdham ||
Translation: Oblation-bearer, deathless, cherisher of strength.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्होता पुरोहितो.अध्वरस्य विचर्षणिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirhotā purohito.adhvarasya vicarṣaṇiḥ |
Translation: 1. AGNI is Priest, the great High Priest of sacrifice, most swift in act:

Sanskit Text: स वेद यज्ञमानुषक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa veda yajñamānuṣak ||
Translation: He knows the rite in constant course.

Sanskit Text: स हव्यवाळ अमर्त्य उशिग दूतस चनोहितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa havyavāḷ amartya uśigh dūtas canohitaḥ |
Translation: 2 Oblation-bearer, deathless, well inclined, an eager messenger,

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्धिया सं रण्वति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirdhiyā saṃ ṛṇvati ||
Translation: Agni comes nigh us with the thought.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्धिया स चेतति केतुर्यज्ञस्य पूर्व्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirdhiyā sa cetati keturyajñasya pūrvyaḥ |
Translation: 3 Ensign of sacrifice from of old, Agni well knoweth with his thought

Sanskit Text: अर्थं हयस्य तरणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arthaṃ hyasya taraṇi ||
Translation: To prosper this man's aim and hope.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं सूनुं सनश्रुतं सहसो जातवेदसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ sūnuṃ sanaśrutaṃ sahaso jātavedasam |
Translation: 4 Agni, illustrious from old time, the Son of Strength who knows all life,

Sanskit Text: वह्निं देवाक्र्ण्वत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vahniṃ devāakṛṇvata ||
Translation: The Gods have made to their Priest.

Sanskit Text: अदाभ्यः पुरेता विशामग्निर्मानुषीणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adābhyaḥ puraetā viśāmaghnirmānuṣīṇām |
Translation: 5 Infallible is Agni, he who goes before the tribes of men,

Sanskit Text: तूर्णी रथः सदा नवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tūrṇī rathaḥ sadā navaḥ ||
Translation: A chariot swift and ever new.

Sanskit Text: साह्वान विश्वा अभियुजः करतुर्देवानामम्र्क्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sāhvān viśvā abhiyujaḥ kraturdevānāmamṛktaḥ |
Translation: 6 Strength of the Gods which none may harm, subduing all his enemies,

Sanskit Text: अग्निस्तुविश्रवस्तमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnistuviśravastamaḥ ||
Translation: Agni is mightiest in fame.

Sanskit Text: अभि परयांसि वाहसा दाश्वानश्नोति मर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi prayāṃsi vāhasā dāśvānaśnoti martyaḥ |
Translation: 7 By offering sacred food to him the mortal worshipper obtains.

Sanskit Text: कषयं पावकशोचिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣayaṃ pāvakaśociṣaḥ ||
Translation: A home from him whose light makes pure.

Sanskit Text: परि विश्वानि सुधिताग्नेरश्याम मन्मभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari viśvāni sudhitāghneraśyāma manmabhiḥ |
Translation: 8 From Agni, by our hymns, may we gain all things that bring happiness,

Sanskit Text: विप्रासो जातवेदसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viprāso jātavedasaḥ ||
Translation: Singers of him who knows all life.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने विश्वानि वार्या वाजेषु सनिषामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne viśvāni vāryā vājeṣu saniṣāmahe |
Translation: 9 O Agni, in our deeds of might may we obtain all precious things:

Sanskit Text: तवे देवास एरिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve devāsa erire ||
Translation: Tle Gods are centred all in thee.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी आ गतं सुतं गीर्भिर्नभो वरेण्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī ā ghataṃ sutaṃ ghīrbhirnabho vareṇyam |
Translation: 1. MOVED, Indra-Agni, by our hymn, come to the juice, the precious dew:

Sanskit Text: अस्य पातं धियेषिता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya pātaṃ dhiyeṣitā ||
Translation: Drink ye thereof, impelled by song.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी जरितुः सचा यज्ञो जिगाति चेतनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī jarituḥ sacā yajño jighāti cetanaḥ |
Translation: 2 O Indra-Agni, with the man who lauds you comes the wakening rite:

Sanskit Text: अया पातमिमं सुतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayā pātamimaṃ sutam ||
Translation: So drink ye both this juice assured.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रमग्निं कविछदा यज्ञस्य जूत्या वर्णे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indramaghniṃ kavichadā yajñasya jūtyā vṛṇe |
Translation: 3 Through force of sacrifice I choose Indra-Agni who love the wise:

Sanskit Text: ता सोमस्येह तर्म्पताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā somasyeha tṛmpatām ||
Translation: With Soma let these sate them here.

Sanskit Text: तोशा वर्त्रहणा हुवे सजित्वानापराजिता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tośā vṛtrahaṇā huve sajitvānāparājitā |
Translation: 4 Indra and Agni I invoke, joint-victors, bounteous, unsubdued,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी वाजसातमा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī vājasātamā ||
Translation: Foe-slayers, best to win the spoil.

Sanskit Text: पर वामर्चन्त्युक्थिनो नीथाविदो जरितारः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vāmarcantyukthino nīthāvido jaritāraḥ |
Translation: 5 Indra and Agni, singers skilled in melody hymn you, bringing lauds:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी इष आ वर्णे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī iṣa ā vṛṇe ||
Translation: I choose you for the sacred food.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी नवतिं पुरो दासपत्नीरधूनुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī navatiṃ puro dāsapatnīradhūnutam |
Translation: 6 Indra and Agni, ye cast down the ninety forts which Dāsas held,

Sanskit Text: साकमेकेन कर्मणा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sākamekena karmaṇā ||
Translation: Together, with one mighty deed.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी अपसस पर्युप पर यन्ति धीतयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī apasas paryupa pra yanti dhītayaḥ |
Translation: 7 To Indra-Agni reverent thoughts go forward from the holy task

Sanskit Text: रतस्य पथ्या अनु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya pathyā anu ||
Translation: Along the path of sacred Law.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी तविषाणि वां सधस्थानि परयांसि च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī taviṣāṇi vāṃ sadhasthāni prayāṃsi ca |
Translation: 8 O Indra-Agni, powers are yours, and dwellings and delightful food

Sanskit Text: युवोरप्तूर्यं हितम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvoraptūryaṃ hitam ||
Translation: Good is your readiness to act.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी रोचना दिवः परि वाजेषु भूषथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī rocanā divaḥ pari vājeṣu bhūṣathaḥ |
Translation: 9 Indra and Agni, in your deeds of might ye deck heaven's lucid realms:

Sanskit Text: तद वांचेति पर वीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad vāṃceti pra vīryam ||
Translation: Famed is that hero strength of yours.

Sanskit Text: पर वो देवायाग्नये बर्हिष्ठमर्चास्मै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vo devāyāghnaye barhiṣṭhamarcāsmai |
Translation: 1. To Agni, to this God of yours I sing aloud with utmost power.

Sanskit Text: गमद देवेभिरास नो यजिष्ठो बर्हिरा सदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghamad devebhirāsa no yajiṣṭho barhirā sadat ||
Translation: May he come to us with the Gods, and sit, best Offerer, on the grass.

Sanskit Text: रतावा यस्य रोदसी दक्षं सचन्त ऊतयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtāvā yasya rodasī dakṣaṃ sacanta ūtayaḥ |
Translation: 2 The Holy, whose are earth and heaven, and succour waits upon his strength;

Sanskit Text: हविष्मन्तस्तमीळते तं सनिष्यन्तो.अवसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: haviṣmantastamīḷate taṃ saniṣyanto.avase ||
Translation: Him men who bring oblations laud, and they who wish to gain, for grace.

Sanskit Text: स यन्ता विप्र एषां स यज्ञानामथा हि षः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa yantā vipra eṣāṃ sa yajñānāmathā hi ṣaḥ |
Translation: 3 He is the Sage who guides these men, Leader of sacred rites is he.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं तं वो दुवस्यत दाता यो वनिता मघम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ taṃ vo duvasyata dātā yo vanitā magham ||
Translation: Him your own Agni, serve ye well, who winneth and bestoweth wealth.

Sanskit Text: स नः शर्माणि वीतये.अग्निर्यछतु शन्तमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ śarmāṇi vītaye.aghniryachatu śantamā |
Translation: 4 So may the gracious Agni grant most goodly shelter for our use;

Sanskit Text: यतो नःप्रुष्णवद वसु दिवि कषितिभ्यो अप्स्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yato naḥpruṣṇavad vasu divi kṣitibhyo apsvā ||
Translation: Whence in the heavens or in the floods he shall pour wealth upon our lands.

Sanskit Text: दीदिवांसमपूर्व्यं वस्वीभिरस्य धीतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dīdivāṃsamapūrvyaṃ vasvībhirasya dhītibhiḥ |
Translation: 5 The singers kindle him, the Priest, Agni the Lord of tribes of men,

Sanskit Text: रक्वाणो अग्निमिन्धते होतारं विश्पतिं विशाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛkvāṇo aghnimindhate hotāraṃ viśpatiṃ viśām ||
Translation: Resplendent and without a peer through his own excellent designs.

Sanskit Text: उत नो बरह्मन्नविष उक्थेषु देवहूतमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta no brahmannaviṣa uktheṣu devahūtamaḥ |
Translation: 6 Help us, thou Brahman, best of all invokers of the Gods in song.

Sanskit Text: शं नः शोचामरुद्व्र्धो.अग्ने सहस्रसातमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ naḥ śocāmarudvṛdho.aghne sahasrasātamaḥ ||
Translation: Beam, Friend of Maruts, bliss on us, O Agni, a most liberal God.

Sanskit Text: नू नो रास्व सहस्रवत तोकवत पुष्टिमद वसु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū no rāsva sahasravat tokavat puṣṭimad vasu |
Translation: 7 Yea, grant us treasure thousandfold with children and with nourishment,

Sanskit Text: दयुमदग्ने सुवीर्यं वर्षिष्थमनुपक्षितम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyumadaghne suvīryaṃ varṣiṣthamanupakṣitam ||
Translation: And, Agni, splendid hero strength, exalted, wasting not away.

Sanskit Text: आ होता मन्द्रो विदथान्यस्थात सत्यो यज्वा कवितमः सवेधाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā hotā mandro vidathānyasthāt satyo yajvā kavitamaḥ savedhāḥ |
Translation: 1 THE pleasant Priest is come into the synod, true, skilled in sacrifice, most wise, Ordainer.

Sanskit Text: विद्युद्रथः सहसस पुत्रो अग्निः शोचिष्केशः पर्थिव्यां पाजो अश्रेत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidyudrathaḥ sahasas putro aghniḥ śociṣkeśaḥ pṛthivyāṃ pājo aśret ||
Translation: Agni, the Son of Strength, whose car is lightning, whose hair is flame, hath shown on earth his lustre.

Sanskit Text: अयामि ते नमौक्तिं जुषस्व रतावस्तुभ्यं चेतते सहस्वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayāmi te namauktiṃ juṣasva ṛtāvastubhyaṃ cetate sahasvaḥ |
Translation: 2 To thee I offer reverent speech: accept it: to thee who markest it, victorious, faithful!

Sanskit Text: विद्वाना वक्षि विदुषो नि षत्सि मध्य आ बर्हिरूतये यजत्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidvānā vakṣi viduṣo ni ṣatsi madhya ā barhirūtaye yajatra ||
Translation: Bring, thou who knowest, those who know, and seat thee amid the sacred grass, for help, O Holy.

Sanskit Text: दरवतां त उषसा वाजयन्ती अग्ने वातस्य पथ्याभिरछ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dravatāṃ ta uṣasā vājayantī aghne vātasya pathyābhiracha |
Translation: 3 The Two who show their vigour, Night and Morning, by the wind's paths shall haste to thee O Agni.

Sanskit Text: यत सीमञ्जन्ति पूर्व्यं हविर्भिरा वन्धुरेव तस्थतुर्दुरोणे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat sīmañjanti pūrvyaṃ havirbhirā vandhureva tasthaturduroṇe ||
Translation: When men adorn the Ancient with oblations, these seek, as on two chariot-seats, the dwelling.

Sanskit Text: मित्रश्च तुभ्यं वरुणः सहस्वो.अग्ने विश्वे मरुतः सुम्नमर्चन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitraśca tubhyaṃ varuṇaḥ sahasvo.aghne viśve marutaḥ sumnamarcan |
Translation: 4 To thee, strong Agni! Varuṇa and Mitra and all the Maruts sang a song of triumph,

Sanskit Text: यच्छोचिषा सहसस पुत्र तिष्ठा अभि कषितीः परथयन सूर्यो नॄन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yacchociṣā sahasas putra tiṣṭhā abhi kṣitīḥ prathayan sūryo nṝn ||
Translation: What time unto the people's lands thou camest, spreading them as the Sun of men, with lustre.

Sanskit Text: वयं ते अद्य ररिमा हि काममुत्तानहस्ता नमसोपसद्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ te adya rarimā hi kāmamuttānahastā namasopasadya |
Translation: 5 Approaching with raised hands and adoration, we have this day fulfilled for thee thy longing.

Sanskit Text: यजिष्ठेन मनसा यक्षि देवानस्रेधता मन्मना विप्रो अग्ने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajiṣṭhena manasā yakṣi devānasredhatā manmanā vipro aghne ||
Translation: Worship the Gods with most devoted spirit, a Priest with no unfriendly thought, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: तवद धि पुत्र सहसो वि पूर्वीर्देवस्य यन्त्यूतयो वि वाजाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvad dhi putra sahaso vi pūrvīrdevasya yantyūtayo vi vājāḥ |
Translation: 6 For, Son of Strength, from thee come many succours, and powers abundant that a God possesses.

Sanskit Text: तवं देहि सहस्रिणं रयिं नो.अद्रोघेण वचसा सत्यमग्ने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ dehi sahasriṇaṃ rayiṃ no.adrogheṇa vacasā satyamaghne ||
Translation: Agni, to us with speech that hath no falsehood grant riches, real, to be told in thousands.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्यं दक्ष कविक्रतो यानीमा देव मर्तासो अध्वरे अकर्म |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyaṃ dakṣa kavikrato yānīmā deva martāso adhvare akarma |
Translation: 7 Whatever, God, in sacrifice we mortals have wrought is all for thee, strong, wise of purpose!

Sanskit Text: तवं विश्वस्य सुरथस्य बोधि सर्वं तदग्ने अम्र्त सवदेह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ viśvasya surathasya bodhi sarvaṃ tadaghne amṛta svadeha ||
Translation: Be thou the Friend of each good chariot's master. All this enjoy thou here, immortal Agni.

Sanskit Text: अयमग्निः सुवीर्यस्येशे महः सौभगस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayamaghniḥ suvīryasyeśe mahaḥ saubhaghasya |
Translation: 1. THIS Agni is the Lord of great felicity and hero Strength;

Sanskit Text: राय ईशे सवपत्यस्य गोमत ईशे वर्त्रहथानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāya īśe svapatyasya ghomata īśe vṛtrahathānām ||
Translation: Lord of wealth in herds of kine; Lord of the battles with the foe.

Sanskit Text: इमं नरो मरुतः सश्चता वर्धं यस्मिन रायः शेव्र्धासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ naro marutaḥ saścatā vṛdhaṃ yasmin rāyaḥ śevṛdhāsaḥ |
Translation: 2 Wait, Maruts, Heroes, upon him the Prosperer in whom is bliss-increasing wealth;

Sanskit Text: अभि ये सन्ति पर्तनासु दूढ्यो विश्वाहा शत्रुमादभुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi ye santi pṛtanāsu dūḍhyo viśvāhā śatrumādabhuḥ ||
Translation: Who in fights ever conquer evil-hearted men, who overcome the enemy.

Sanskit Text: स तवं नो रायः शिशीहि मीढ्वो अग्ने सुविर्यस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvaṃ no rāyaḥ śiśīhi mīḍhvo aghne suviryasya |
Translation: 3 As such, O Agni, deal us wealth and hero might, O Bounteous One!

Sanskit Text: तुविद्युम्न वर्षिष्ठस्य परजावतो.अनमीवस्य शुष्मिणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tuvidyumna varṣiṣṭhasya prajāvato.anamīvasya śuṣmiṇaḥ ||
Translation: Most lofty, very glorious, rich in progeny, free from disease and full of power.

Sanskit Text: चक्रिर्यो विश्वा भुवनाभि सासहिश्चक्रिर्देवेष्वा दुवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakriryo viśvā bhuvanābhi sāsahiścakrirdeveṣvā duvaḥ |
Translation: 4 He who made all that lives, who passes all in might, who orders service to the Gods,

Sanskit Text: आ देवेषु यतत आ सुवीर्य आ शंस उत नर्णाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā deveṣu yatata ā suvīrya ā śaṃsa uta nṛṇām ||
Translation: He works among the Gods, he works in hero strength, yea, also in the praise of men.

Sanskit Text: मा नो अग्ने.अमतये मावीरतायै रीरधः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no aghne.amataye māvīratāyai rīradhaḥ |
Translation: 5 Give us not up to indigence, Agni, nor want of hero sons,

Sanskit Text: मागोतायै सहसस पुत्र मा निदे.अप दवेषांस्या कर्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: māghotāyai sahasas putra mā nide.apa dveṣāṃsyā kṛdhi ||
Translation: Nor, Son of Strength, to lack of cattle, nor to blame. Drive. thou our enemies away.

Sanskit Text: शग्धि वाजस्य सुभग परजावतो.अग्ने बर्हतो अध्वरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaghdhi vājasya subhagha prajāvato.aghne bṛhato adhvare |
Translation: 6 Help us to strength, blest Agni! rich in progeny, abundant, in our sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: संराया भूयसा सर्ज मयोभुना तुविद्युम्न यशस्वता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃrāyā bhūyasā sṛja mayobhunā tuvidyumna yaśasvatā ||
Translation: Flood us with riches yet more plenteous, bringing weal, with high renown, most Glorious One!

Sanskit Text: भवा नो अग्ने सुमना उपेतौ सखेव सख्ये पितरेव साधुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhavā no aghne sumanā upetau sakheva sakhye pitareva sādhuḥ |
Translation: 1. AGNI, be kind to us when we approach thee good as a friend to friend, as sire and mother.

Sanskit Text: पुरुद्रुहो हि कषितयो जनानां परति परतीचीर्दहतादरातीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purudruho hi kṣitayo janānāṃ prati pratīcīrdahatādarātīḥ ||
Translation: The races of mankind are great oppressors burn up malignity that strives against us.

Sanskit Text: तपो शवग्ने अन्तरानमित्रान तपा शंसमररुषः परस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tapo śvaghne antarānamitrān tapā śaṃsamararuṣaḥ parasya |
Translation: 2 Agni, burn up the unfriendly who are near us, burn thou the foeman's curse who pays no worship.

Sanskit Text: तपो वसो चिकितानो अचित्तान वि ते तिष्ठन्तामजरा अयासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tapo vaso cikitāno acittān vi te tiṣṭhantāmajarā ayāsaḥ ||
Translation: Burn, Vasu, thou who markest well, the foolish: let thine eternal nimble beams surround thee.

Sanskit Text: इध्मेनाग्न इछमानो घर्तेन जुहोमि हव्यं तरसे बलाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idhmenāghna ichamāno ghṛtena juhomi havyaṃ tarase balāya |
Translation: 3 With fuel, Agni, and with oil, desirous, mine offering I present for strength and conquest,

Sanskit Text: यावदीशे बरह्मणा वन्दमान इमां धियं शतसेयाय देवीम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāvadīśe brahmaṇā vandamāna imāṃ dhiyaṃ śataseyāya devīm ||
Translation: With prayer, so far as I have power, adoring-this hymn divine to gain a hundred treasures.

Sanskit Text: उच्छोचिषा सहसस पुत्र सतुतो बर्हद वयः शशमानेषु धेहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ucchociṣā sahasas putra stuto bṛhad vayaḥ śaśamāneṣu dhehi |
Translation: 4 Give with thy glow, thou Son of Strength, when lauded, great vital power to those who toil to serve thee.

Sanskit Text: रेवदग्ने विश्वामित्रेषु शं योर्मर्म्र्ज्मा ते तन्वं भूरि कर्त्वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: revadaghne viśvāmitreṣu śaṃ yormarmṛjmā te tanvaṃ bhūri kṛtvaḥ ||
Translation: Give richly, Agni, to the Viśvāmitras in rest and stir. Oft have we decked thy body.

Sanskit Text: कर्धि रत्नं सुसनितर्धनानां स घेदग्ने भवसि यत समिद्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛdhi ratnaṃ susanitardhanānāṃ sa ghedaghne bhavasi yat samiddhaḥ |
Translation: 5 Give us, O liberal Lord, great store of riches, for, Agni, such art thou when duly kindled.

Sanskit Text: सतोतुर्दुरोणे सुभगस्य रेवत सर्प्रा करस्ना दधिषे वपूंषि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stoturduroṇe subhaghasya revat sṛprā karasnā dadhiṣe vapūṃṣi ||
Translation: Thou in the happy singer's home bestowest, amply with arms extended, things of beauty.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं होतारं पर वर्णे मियेधे गर्त्सं कविं विश्वविदममूरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ hotāraṃ pra vṛṇe miyedhe ghṛtsaṃ kaviṃ viśvavidamamūram |
Translation: 1. AGNI, quick, sage, infallible, all-knowing, I choose to be our Priest at this oblation.

Sanskit Text: स नो यक्षद देवताता यजीयान राये वाजाय वनतेमघानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no yakṣad devatātā yajīyān rāye vājāya vanatemaghāni ||
Translation: In our Gods’ service he, best skilled, shall worship: may he obtain us boons for strength and riches.

Sanskit Text: पर ते अग्ने हविष्मतीमियर्म्यछा सुद्युम्नां रातिनीं घर्ताचीम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te aghne haviṣmatīmiyarmyachā sudyumnāṃ rātinīṃ ghṛtācīm |
Translation: 2 Agni, to thee I lift the oil-fed ladle, bright, with an offering, bearing our oblation.

Sanskit Text: परदक्षिणिद देवतातिमुराणः सं रातिभिर्वसुभिर्यज्ञमश्रेत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pradakṣiṇid devatātimurāṇaḥ saṃ rātibhirvasubhiryajñamaśret ||
Translation: From the right hand, choosing the Gods’ attendance, he with rich presents hath arranged the worship.

Sanskit Text: स तेजीयसा मनसा तवोत उत शिक्ष सवपत्यस्य शिक्षोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tejīyasā manasā tvota uta śikṣa svapatyasya śikṣoḥ |
Translation: 3 Of keenest spirit is the man thou aidest give us good offspring, thou who givest freely.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने रायो नर्तमस्य परभूतौ भूयाम ते सुष्टुतयश्च वस्वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne rāyo nṛtamasya prabhūtau bhūyāma te suṣṭutayaśca vasvaḥ ||
Translation: In power of wealth most rich in men. O Agni, of thee, the Good, may we sing forth fair praises.

Sanskit Text: भूरीणि हि तवे दधिरे अनीकाग्ने देवस्य यज्यवो जनासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūrīṇi hi tve dadhire anīkāghne devasya yajyavo janāsaḥ |
Translation: 4 Men as they worship thee the God, O Agni, have set on thee full many a brilliant, aspect.

Sanskit Text: स आ वह देवतातिं यविष्ठ शर्धो यदद्य दिव्यंयजासि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ā vaha devatātiṃ yaviṣṭha śardho yadadya divyaṃyajāsi ||
Translation: So bring Most Youthful One, the Gods’ assembly, the Heavenly Host which thou to-day shalt honour.

Sanskit Text: यत तवा होतारमनजन मियेधे निषादयन्तो यजथाय देवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat tvā hotāramanajan miyedhe niṣādayanto yajathāya devāḥ |
Translation: 5 When Gods anoint thee Priest at their oblation, and seat thee for thy task as Sacrificer,

Sanskit Text: स तवं नो अग्ने.अवितेह बोध्यधि शरवांसि धेहि नस्तनूषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvaṃ no aghne.aviteha bodhyadhi śravāṃsi dhehi nastanūṣu ||
Translation: O Agni, be thou here our kind defender, and to ourselves vouchsafe the gift of glory.

Sanskit Text: अग्निमुषसमश्विना दधिक्रां वयुष्टिषु हवते वह्निरुक्थैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnimuṣasamaśvinā dadhikrāṃ vyuṣṭiṣu havate vahnirukthaiḥ |
Translation: 1. WITH lauds at break of morn the priest invoketh Agni, Dawn, Dadhikrās, and both the Aśvins.

Sanskit Text: सुज्योतिषो नः शर्ण्वन्तु देवाः सजोषसो अध्वरं वावशानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sujyotiṣo naḥ śṛṇvantu devāḥ sajoṣaso adhvaraṃ vāvaśānāḥ ||
Translation: With one consent the Gods whose light is splendid, longing to taste our sacrifice, shall hear us.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने तरी ते वाजिना तरी षधस्था तिस्रस्ते जिह्वा रतजात पूर्वीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne trī te vājinā trī ṣadhasthā tisraste jihvā ṛtajāta pūrvīḥ |
Translation: 2 Three are thy powers, O Agni, three thy stations, three are thy tongues, yea, many, Child of Order!

Sanskit Text: तिस्र उ ते तन्वो देववातास्ताभिर्नः पाहि गिरो अप्रयुछन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisra u te tanvo devavātāstābhirnaḥ pāhi ghiro aprayuchan ||
Translation: Three bodies hast thou which the Gods delight in: with these protect our hymns with care unceasing.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने भूरीणि तव जातवेदो देव सवधावो.अम्र्तस्य नाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne bhūrīṇi tava jātavedo deva svadhāvo.amṛtasya nāma |
Translation: 3 O Agni, many are the names thou bearest, immortal, God, Divine, and Jātavedas.

Sanskit Text: याश्च माया मायिनां विश्वमिन्व तवे पूर्वीः सन्दधुःप्र्ष्टबन्धो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāśca māyā māyināṃ viśvaminva tve pūrvīḥ sandadhuḥpṛṣṭabandho ||
Translation: And many charms of charmers, All-Inspirer! have they laid in thee, Lord of true attendants!

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्नेता भग इव कषितीनां दैवीनां देव रतुपा रतावा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirnetā bhagha iva kṣitīnāṃ daivīnāṃ deva ṛtupā ṛtāvā |
Translation: 4 Agni, like Bhaga, leads the godly people, he who is true to Law and guards the seasons.

Sanskit Text: स वर्त्रहा सनयो विश्ववेदाः पर्षद विश्वाति दुरिता गर्णन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vṛtrahā sanayo viśvavedāḥ parṣad viśvāti duritā ghṛṇantam ||
Translation: Ancient, all-knowing, he the Vṛtra-slayer shall bear the singer safe through every trouble.

Sanskit Text: ददहिक्रामग्निमुषसं च देवीं बर्हस्पतिं सवितारं चदेवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadahikrāmaghnimuṣasaṃ ca devīṃ bṛhaspatiṃ savitāraṃ cadevam |
Translation: 5 I call on Savitar the God, on Morning, Bṛhaspati, and Dadhikrās, and Agni,

Sanskit Text: अश्विना मित्रावरुणा भगं च वसून रुद्रानादित्यानिह हुवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvinā mitrāvaruṇā bhaghaṃ ca vasūn rudrānādityāniha huve ||
Translation: On Varuṇa and Mitra, on the Aśvins, Bhaga, the Vasus, Rudras and Ādityas.

Sanskit Text: इमं नो यज्ञमम्र्तेषु धेहीमा हव्या जातवेदो जुषस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ no yajñamamṛteṣu dhehīmā havyā jātavedo juṣasva |
Translation: 1. SET this our sacrifice among the Immortals: be pleased with these our presents, Jātavedas.

Sanskit Text: सतोकानामग्ने मेदसो घर्तस्य होतः पराशान परथमो निषद्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stokānāmaghne medaso ghṛtasya hotaḥ prāśāna prathamo niṣadya ||
Translation: O Priest, O Agni, sit thee down before us, and first enjoy the drops of oil and fatness.

Sanskit Text: घर्तवन्तः पावक ते सतोका शचोतन्ति मेदसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtavantaḥ pāvaka te stokā ścotanti medasaḥ |
Translation: 2 For thee, O Purifier, flow the drops of fatness rich in oil.

Sanskit Text: सवधर्मन देववीतये शरेष्ठं नो धेहि वार्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svadharman devavītaye śreṣṭhaṃ no dhehi vāryam ||
Translation: After thy wont vouchsafe to us the choicest boon that Gods may feast.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्यं सतोका घर्तश्चुतो.अग्ने विप्राय सन्त्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyaṃ stokā ghṛtaścuto.aghne viprāya santya |
Translation: 3 Agni, Most Excellent! for thee the Sage are drops that drip with oil.

Sanskit Text: रषिः शरेष्ठः समिध्यसे यज्ञस्य पराविता भव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṣiḥ śreṣṭhaḥ samidhyase yajñasya prāvitā bhava ||
Translation: Thou art enkindled as the best of Seers. Help thou the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्यं शचोतन्त्यध्रिगो शचीव सतोकासो अग्ने मेदसो घर्तस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyaṃ ścotantyadhrigho śacīva stokāso aghne medaso ghṛtasya |
Translation: 4 To thee, O Agni, mighty and resistless, to thee stream forth the drops of oil and fatness.

Sanskit Text: कविशस्तो बर्हता भानुनागा हव्या जुषस्व मेधिर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaviśasto bṛhatā bhānunāghā havyā juṣasva medhira ||
Translation: With great light art thou come, O praised by poets! Accept our offering, O thou Sage.

Sanskit Text: ओजिष्ठं ते मध्यतो मेद उद्भ्र्तं पर ते वयं ददामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ojiṣṭhaṃ te madhyato meda udbhṛtaṃ pra te vayaṃ dadāmahe |
Translation: 5 Fatness exceeding rich, extracted from the midst,—this as our gift we offer thee.

Sanskit Text: शचोतन्ति ते वसो सतोका अधि तवचि परति तान देवशो विहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ścotanti te vaso stokā adhi tvaci prati tān devaśo vihi ||
Translation: Excellent God, the drops run down upon thy skin. Deal them to each among the Gods.

Sanskit Text: अगने दिवः सूनुरसि परचेतास्तना पर्थिव्या उत विश्ववेदाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne divaḥ sūnurasi pracetāstanā pṛthivyā uta viśvavedāḥ |
Translation: 1. THOU art the sapient Son of Dyaus, O Agni, yes and the Child of Earth, who knowest all things.

Sanskit Text: रधग देवानिह यजा चिकित्वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛdhagh devāniha yajā cikitvaḥ ||
Translation: Bring the Gods specially, thou Sage, for worship.

Sanskit Text: अग्निः सनोति वीर्याणि विद्वान सनोति वाजमम्र्ताय भूषन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniḥ sanoti vīryāṇi vidvān sanoti vājamamṛtāya bhūṣan |
Translation: 2. Agni the wise bestows the might of heroes grants strengthening food, preparing it for nectar.

Sanskit Text: स नो देवानेह वहा पुरुक्षो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no devāneha vahā purukṣo ||
Translation: Thou who art rich in food bring the Gods hither.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्द्यावाप्र्थिवी विश्वजन्ये आ भाति देवी अम्र्ते अमूरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirdyāvāpṛthivī viśvajanye ā bhāti devī amṛte amūraḥ |
Translation: 3 Agni, infallible, lights Earth and Heaven, immortal Goddesses gracious to all men,—

Sanskit Text: कषयन वाजैः पुरुश्चन्द्रो नमोभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣayan vājaiḥ puruścandro namobhiḥ ||
Translation: Lord through his strength, splendid through adorations.

Sanskit Text: अग्न इन्द्रश्च दाशुषो दुरोने सुतावतो यज्ञमिहोप यातम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghna indraśca dāśuṣo durone sutāvato yajñamihopa yātam |
Translation: 4 Come to the sacrifice, Agni and Indra come to the offerer's house who hath the Soma.

Sanskit Text: अमर्धन्ता सोमपेयाय देवा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: amardhantā somapeyāya devā ||
Translation: Come, friendly-minded, Gods, to drink the Soma.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने अपां समिध्यसे दुरोणे नित्यः सूनो सहसो जातवेदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne apāṃ samidhyase duroṇe nityaḥ sūno sahaso jātavedaḥ |
Translation: 5 In the floods' home art thou enkindled, Agni, O Jātavedas, Son of Strength, eternal,

Sanskit Text: सधस्थानि महयमान ऊती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadhasthāni mahayamāna ūtī ||
Translation: Exalting with thine help the gathering-places.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानरं मनसाग्निं निचाय्या हविष्मन्तो अनुषत्यं सवर्विदम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānaraṃ manasāghniṃ nicāyyā haviṣmanto anuṣatyaṃ svarvidam |
Translation: 1. REVERING in our heart Agni Vaiśvānara, the finder of the light, whose promises are true,

Sanskit Text: सुदानुं देवं रथिरं वसूयवो गीर्भी रण्वंकुशिकासो हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sudānuṃ devaṃ rathiraṃ vasūyavo ghīrbhī raṇvaṃkuśikāso havāmahe ||
Translation: The liberal, gladsome, car-borne God we Kuśikas invoke him with oblation, seeking wealth with songs.

Sanskit Text: तं शुभ्रमग्निमवसे हवामहे वैश्वानरं मातरिश्वानमुक्थ्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ śubhramaghnimavase havāmahe vaiśvānaraṃ mātariśvānamukthyam |
Translation: 2 That Agni, bright, Vaiśvānara, we invoke for help, and Mātariśvan worthy of the song of praise;

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिं मनुषो देवतातये विप्रं शरोतारमतिथिं रघुष्यदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiṃ manuṣo devatātaye vipraṃ śrotāramatithiṃ raghuṣyadam ||
Translation: Bṛhaspati for man's observance of the Gods, the Singer prompt to hear, the swiftly-moving guest.

Sanskit Text: अश्वो न करन्दञ जनिभिः समिध्यते वैश्वानरः कुशिकेभिर्युगे-युगे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvo na krandañ janibhiḥ samidhyate vaiśvānaraḥ kuśikebhiryughe-yughe |
Translation: 3 Age after age Vaiśvānara, neighing like a horse, is kindled with the women by the Kuśikas.

Sanskit Text: स नो अग्निः सुवीर्यं सवश्व्यं दधातु रत्नमम्र्तेषु जाग्र्विः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no aghniḥ suvīryaṃ svaśvyaṃ dadhātu ratnamamṛteṣu jāghṛviḥ ||
Translation: May Agni, he who wakes among Immortal Gods, grant us heroic strength and wealth in noble steeds.

Sanskit Text: पर यन्तु वाजास्तविषीभिरग्नयः शुभे सम्मिष्लाः पर्षतीरयुक्षत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yantu vājāstaviṣībhiraghnayaḥ śubhe sammiṣlāḥ pṛṣatīrayukṣata |
Translation: 4 Let them go forth, the strong, as flames of fire with might. Gathered for victory they have yoked their spotted deer.

Sanskit Text: बर्हदुक्षो मरुतो विश्ववेदसः पर वेपयन्तिपर्वतानदाभ्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhadukṣo maruto viśvavedasaḥ pra vepayantiparvatānadābhyāḥ ||
Translation: Pourers of floods, the Maruts, Masters of all wealth, they who can ne’er be conquered, make the mountains shake.

Sanskit Text: अग्निश्रियो मरुतो विश्वक्र्ष्टय आ तवेषमुग्रमव ईमहे वयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniśriyo maruto viśvakṛṣṭaya ā tveṣamughramava īmahe vayam |
Translation: 5 The Maruts, Friends of men, are glorious as the fire: their mighty and resplendent succour we implore.

Sanskit Text: ते सवानिनो रुद्रिया वर्षनिर्णिजः सिंहा न हेषक्रतवः सुदानवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te svānino rudriyā varṣanirṇijaḥ siṃhā na heṣakratavaḥ sudānavaḥ ||
Translation: Those storming Sons of Rudra clothed in robes of rain, boon-givers of good gifts, roar as the lions roar.

Sanskit Text: वरातं-वरातं गणं-गणं सुशस्तिभिरग्नेर्भामं मरुतामोज ईमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vrātaṃ-vrātaṃ ghaṇaṃ-ghaṇaṃ suśastibhiraghnerbhāmaṃ marutāmoja īmahe |
Translation: 6 We, band on band and troop following troop, entreat with fair lauds Agni's splendour and the Maruts’ might,

Sanskit Text: पर्षदश्वासो अनवभ्रराधसो गन्तारो यज्ञं विदथेषु धीराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛṣadaśvāso anavabhrarādhaso ghantāro yajñaṃ vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ ||
Translation: With spotted deer for steeds, with wealth that never fails, they, wise Ones, come to sacrifice at our gatherings.

Sanskit Text: अग्निरस्मि जन्मना जातवेदा घर्तं मे चक्षुरम्र्तं म आसन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirasmi janmanā jātavedā ghṛtaṃ me cakṣuramṛtaṃ ma āsan |
Translation: 7 Agni am I who know, by birth, all creatures. Mine eye is butter, in my mouth is nectar.

Sanskit Text: अर्कस्त्रिधातू रजसो विमानो.अजस्रो घर्मो हविरस्मि नाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arkastridhātū rajaso vimāno.ajasro gharmo havirasmi nāma ||
Translation: I am light threefold, measurer of the region exhaustless heat am I, named burnt-oblation.

Sanskit Text: तरिभिः पवित्रैरपुपोद धयर्कं हर्दा मतिं जयोतिरनु परजानन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tribhiḥ pavitrairapupod dhyarkaṃ hṛdā matiṃ jyotiranu prajānan |
Translation: 8 Bearing in mind a thought with light accordant, he purified the Sun with three refinings;

Sanskit Text: वर्षिष्ठं रत्नमक्र्त सवधाभिरादिद दयावाप्र्थिवी पर्यपश्यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: varṣiṣṭhaṃ ratnamakṛta svadhābhirādid dyāvāpṛthivī paryapaśyat ||
Translation: By his own nature gained the highest treasure, and looked abroad over the earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: शतधारमुत्समक्षीयमाणं विपश्चितं पितरं वक्त्वानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śatadhāramutsamakṣīyamāṇaṃ vipaścitaṃ pitaraṃ vaktvānām |
Translation: 9 The Spring that fails not with a hundred streamlets, Father inspired of prayers that men should utter,

Sanskit Text: मेळिं मदन्तं पित्रोरुपस्थे तं रोदसी पिप्र्तं सत्यवाचम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: meḷiṃ madantaṃ pitrorupasthe taṃ rodasī pipṛtaṃ satyavācam ||
Translation: The Sparkler, joyous in his Parents' bosorn, -him, the Truth-speaker, sate ye, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने जुषस्व नो हविः पुरोळाशं जातवेदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne juṣasva no haviḥ puroḷāśaṃ jātavedaḥ |
Translation: 1. AGNI who knowest all, accept our offering and the cake of meal,

Sanskit Text: परातःसावेधियावसो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātaḥsāvedhiyāvaso ||
Translation: At dawn's libation, rich in prayer!

Sanskit Text: पुरोळा अग्ने पचतस्तुभ्यं वा घा परिष्क्र्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: puroḷā aghne pacatastubhyaṃ vā ghā pariṣkṛtaḥ |
Translation: 2 Agni, the sacrificial cake hath been prepared and dressed for thee:

Sanskit Text: तं जुषस्व यविष्ठ्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ juṣasva yaviṣṭhya ||
Translation: Accept it, O Most Youthful God.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने वीहि पुरोळाषमाहुतं तिरोह्न्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne vīhi puroḷāṣamāhutaṃ tiroahnyam |
Translation: 3 Agni, enjoy the cake of meal and our oblation three days old:

Sanskit Text: सहसः सूनुरस्यध्वरे हितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasaḥ sūnurasyadhvare hitaḥ ||
Translation: Thou, Son of Strength, art stablished at our sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: माध्यन्दिने सवने जातवेदः पुरोळाशमिह कवे जुषस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mādhyandine savane jātavedaḥ puroḷāśamiha kave juṣasva |
Translation: 4 Here at the midday sacrifice enjoy thou the sacrificial cake, wise, Jātavedas!

Sanskit Text: अग्ने यह्वस्य तव भागधेयं न पर मिनन्ति विदथेषु धीराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne yahvasya tava bhāghadheyaṃ na pra minanti vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ ||
Translation: Agni, the sages in assemblies never minish the portion due to thee the Mighty.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने तर्तीये सवने हि कानिषः पुरोळाशं सहसः सूनवाहुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne tṛtīye savane hi kāniṣaḥ puroḷāśaṃ sahasaḥ sūnavāhutam |
Translation: 5 O Agni, at the third libation takewith joy the offered cake of sacrifice, thou, Son of Strength.

Sanskit Text: अथा देवेष्वध्वरं विपन्यया धा रत्नवन्तमम्र्तेषु जाग्र्विम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā deveṣvadhvaraṃ vipanyayā dhā ratnavantamamṛteṣu jāghṛvim ||
Translation: Through skill in song bear to the Gods our sacrifice, watchful and fraught with riches, to Immortal God.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने वर्धान आहुतिं पुरोळाशं जातवेदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne vṛdhāna āhutiṃ puroḷāśaṃ jātavedaḥ |
Translation: 6 O waxing Agni, knower, thou, of all, accept our gifts, the cake,

Sanskit Text: जुषस्व तिरोह्न्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣasva tiroahnyam ||
Translation: And that prepared ere yesterday.

Sanskit Text: अस्तीदमधिमन्थनमस्ति परजननं कर्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: astīdamadhimanthanamasti prajananaṃ kṛtam |
Translation: 1. HERE is the gear for friction, here tinder made ready for the spark.

Sanskit Text: एतां विश्पत्नीमा भराग्निं मन्थाम पूर्वथा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: etāṃ viśpatnīmā bharāghniṃ manthāma pūrvathā ||
Translation: Bring thou the Matron: we will rub Agni in ancient fashion forth.

Sanskit Text: अरण्योर्निहितो जातवेदा गर्भ इव सुधितो गर्भिणीषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: araṇyornihito jātavedā gharbha iva sudhito gharbhiṇīṣu |
Translation: 2 1n the two fire-sticks Jātavedas lieth, even as the well-set germ in pregnant women,

Sanskit Text: दिवे-दिव ईड्यो जाग्र्वद्भिर्हविष्मद्भिर्मनुष्येभिरग्निः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dive-diva īḍyo jāghṛvadbhirhaviṣmadbhirmanuṣyebhiraghniḥ ||
Translation: Agni who day by day must be exalted by men who watch and worship with oblations.

Sanskit Text: उत्तानायामव भरा चिकित्वान सद्यः परवीता वर्षणं जजान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uttānāyāmava bharā cikitvān sadyaḥ pravītā vṛṣaṇaṃ jajāna |
Translation: 3 Lay this with care on that which lies extended: straight hath she borne the Steer when made prolific.

Sanskit Text: अरुषस्तूपो रुशदस्य पाज इळायास पुत्रो वयुने.अजनिष्ट ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aruṣastūpo ruśadasya pāja iḷāyās putro vayune.ajaniṣṭa ||
Translation: With his red pillar—radiant is his splendour—in our skilled task is born the Son of Iḷā.

Sanskit Text: इळायास्त्वा पदे वयं नाभा पर्थिव्या अधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iḷāyāstvā pade vayaṃ nābhā pṛthivyā adhi |
Translation: 4 In Iḷā's place we set thee down, upon the central point of earth,

Sanskit Text: जातवेदो नि धीमह्यग्ने हव्याय वोळ्हवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jātavedo ni dhīmahyaghne havyāya voḷhave ||
Translation: That, Agni Jātavedas, thou mayst bear our offerings to the Gods.

Sanskit Text: मन्थता नरः कविमद्वयन्तं परचेतसमम्र्तं सुप्रतीकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: manthatā naraḥ kavimadvayantaṃ pracetasamamṛtaṃ supratīkam |
Translation: 5 Rub into life, ye men, the Sage, the guileless, Immortal, very wise and fair to look on.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञस्य केतुं परथमं पुरस्तादग्निं नरो जनयता सुशेवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñasya ketuṃ prathamaṃ purastādaghniṃ naro janayatā suśevam ||
Translation: O men, bring forth the most propitious Agni, first ensign of the sacrifice to eastward.

Sanskit Text: यदी मन्थन्ति बाहुभिर्वि रोचते.अश्वो न वाज्यरुषो वनेष्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadī manthanti bāhubhirvi rocate.aśvo na vājyaruṣo vaneṣvā |
Translation: 6 When with their arms they rub him straight he shineth forth like a strong courser, red in colour, in the wood.

Sanskit Text: चित्रो न यामन्नश्विनोरनिव्र्तः परि वर्णक्त्यश्मनस्त्र्णा दहन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: citro na yāmannaśvinoranivṛtaḥ pari vṛṇaktyaśmanastṛṇā dahan ||
Translation: Bright, checkless, as it were upon the Aśvins' path, he passeth by the stones and burneth up the grass.

Sanskit Text: जातो अग्नी रोचते चेकितानो वाजी विप्रः कविशस्तः सुदानुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jāto aghnī rocate cekitāno vājī vipraḥ kaviśastaḥ sudānuḥ |
Translation: 7 Agni shines forth when born, observant, mighty, the bountiful, the Singer praised by sages;

Sanskit Text: यं देवास ईड्यं विश्वविदं हव्यवाहमदधुरध्वरेषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ devāsa īḍyaṃ viśvavidaṃ havyavāhamadadhuradhvareṣu ||
Translation: Whom, as adorable and knowing all things, Gods set at solemn rites as offering-bearer.

Sanskit Text: सीद होतः सव उ लोके चिकित्वान सादया यज्ञं सुक्र्तस्य योनौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sīda hotaḥ sva u loke cikitvān sādayā yajñaṃ sukṛtasya yonau |
Translation: 8 Set thee, O Priest, in, thine own place, observant: lay down the sacrifice in the home of worship.

Sanskit Text: देवावीर्देवान हविषा यजास्यग्ने बर्हद यजमाने वयो धाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāvīrdevān haviṣā yajāsyaghne bṛhad yajamāne vayo dhāḥ ||
Translation: Thou, dear to Gods, shalt serve them with oblation: Agni, give long life to the sacrificer.

Sanskit Text: कर्णोत धूमं वर्षणं सखायो.अस्रेधन्त इतन वाजमछ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṇota dhūmaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ sakhāyo.asredhanta itana vājamacha |
Translation: 9 Raise ye a mighty smoke, my fellow-workers! Ye shall attain to wealth without obstruction.

Sanskit Text: अयमग्निः पर्तनाषाट सुवीरो येन देवासो असहन्त दस्यून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayamaghniḥ pṛtanāṣāṭ suvīro yena devāso asahanta dasyūn ||
Translation: This Agni is the battle-winning Hero by whom the Gods have overcome the Dasyus.

Sanskit Text: अयं ते योनिर्र्त्वियो यतो जातो अरोचथाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ te yonirṛtviyo yato jāto arocathāḥ |
Translation: 10 This is thine ordered place of birth whence sprung to life thou shonest forth.

Sanskit Text: तं जानन्नग्न आ सीदाथा नो वर्धया गिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ jānannaghna ā sīdāthā no vardhayā ghiraḥ ||
Translation: Knowing this, Agni, sit thee down, and prosper thou the songs we sing.

Sanskit Text: तनूनपादुच्यते गर्भ आसुरो नराशंसो भवति यद विजायते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tanūnapāducyate gharbha āsuro narāśaṃso bhavati yad vijāyate |
Translation: 11 As Germ Celestial he is called Tanūnapāt, and Narāśaṁsa born diffused in varied shape.

Sanskit Text: मातरिश्वा यदमिमीत मातरि वातस्य सर्गो अभवत्सरीमणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mātariśvā yadamimīta mātari vātasya sargho abhavatsarīmaṇi ||
Translation: Formed in his Mother he is Mātariśvan; he hath, in his course, become the rapid flight of wind.

Sanskit Text: सुनिर्मथा निर्मथितः सुनिधा निहितः कविः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sunirmathā nirmathitaḥ sunidhā nihitaḥ kaviḥ |
Translation: 12 With strong attrition rubbed to life, laid down with careful hand, a Sage,

Sanskit Text: अग्ने सवध्वरा कर्णु देवान देवयते यज ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne svadhvarā kṛṇu devān devayate yaja ||
Translation: Agni, make sacrifices good, and for the pious bring the Gods.

Sanskit Text: अजीजनन्नम्र्तं मर्त्यासो.अस्रेमाणं तरणिं वीळुजम्भम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajījanannamṛtaṃ martyāso.asremāṇaṃ taraṇiṃ vīḷujambham |
Translation: 13 Mortals have brought to life the God Immortal, the Conqueror with mighty jaws, unfailing.

Sanskit Text: दश सवसारो अग्रुवः समीचीः पुमांसं जातमभि सं रभन्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśa svasāro aghruvaḥ samīcīḥ pumāṃsaṃ jātamabhi saṃ rabhante ||
Translation: The sisters ten, unwedded and united, together grasp the Babe, the new-born Infant.

Sanskit Text: पर सप्तहोता सनकादरोचत मातुरुपस्थे यदशोचदूधनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra saptahotā sanakādarocata māturupasthe yadaśocadūdhani |
Translation: 14 Served by the seven priests, he shone forth from ancient time, when in his Mother's bosom, in her lap, he glowed.

Sanskit Text: न नि मिषति सुरणो दिवे-दिवे यदसुरस्य जठरादजायत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na ni miṣati suraṇo dive-dive yadasurasya jaṭharādajāyata ||
Translation: Giving delight each day he closeth not his eye, since from the Asura's body hewas brought to life.

Sanskit Text: अमित्रायुधो मरुतामिव परयाः परथमजा बरह्मणो विश्वमिद विदुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: amitrāyudho marutāmiva prayāḥ prathamajā brahmaṇo viśvamid viduḥ |
Translation: 15 Even as the Maruts, onslaughts who attack the foe, those born the first of all knew the full power of prayer.

Sanskit Text: दयुम्नवद बरह्म कुशिकास एरिर एक-एको दमे अग्निं समीधिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyumnavad brahma kuśikāsa erira eka-eko dame aghniṃ samīdhire ||
Translation: The Kuśikas have made the glorious hymn ascend, and, each one singly in his home, have kindled fire.

Sanskit Text: यदद्य तवा परयति यज्ञे अस्मिन होतश्चिकित्वो.अव्र्णीमहीह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadadya tvā prayati yajñe asmin hotaścikitvo.avṛṇīmahīha |
Translation: 16 As we, O Priest observant, have elected thee this day, what time the solemn sacrifice began,

Sanskit Text: धरुवमया धरुवमुताशमिष्ठाः परजानन विद्वानुप याहि सोमम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhruvamayā dhruvamutāśamiṣṭhāḥ prajānan vidvānupa yāhi somam ||
Translation: So surely hast thou worshipped, surely hast thou toiled: come thou unto the Soma, wise and knowing all.

Sanskit Text: इछन्ति तवा सोम्यासः सखायः सुन्वन्ति सोमं दधति परयांसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ichanti tvā somyāsaḥ sakhāyaḥ sunvanti somaṃ dadhati prayāṃsi |
Translation: 1. THE friends who offer Soma long to find thee: they pour forth Soma and present their viands.

Sanskit Text: तितिक्षन्ते अभिशस्तिं जनानामिन्द्र तवदा कश्चन हि परकेतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: titikṣante abhiśastiṃ janānāmindra tvadā kaścana hi praketaḥ ||
Translation: They bear unmoved the cursing of the people, for all our wisdom comes from thee, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: न ते दूरे परमा चिद रजांस्या तु पर याहि हरिवो हरिभ्याम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na te dūre paramā cid rajāṃsyā tu pra yāhi harivo haribhyām |
Translation: 2 Not far for thee are mid-air's loftiest regions: start hither, Lord of Bays, with thy Bay Horses.

Sanskit Text: सथिराय वर्ष्णे सवना कर्तेमा युक्ता गरावाणः समिधाने अग्नौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sthirāya vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtemā yuktā ghrāvāṇaḥ samidhāne aghnau ||
Translation: Made for the Firm and Strong are these libations. The pressing-stones are set and fire is kindled.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रः सुशिप्रो मघवा तरुत्रो महाव्रातस्तुविकूर्मिर्र्घावान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraḥ suśipro maghavā tarutro mahāvrātastuvikūrmirṛghāvān |
Translation: 3 Fair cheeks hath Indra, Maghavan, the Victor, Lord of a great host, Stormer, strong in action.

Sanskit Text: यदुग्रो धा बाधितो मर्त्येषु कव तया ते वर्षभ वीर्याणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadughro dhā bādhito martyeṣu kva tyā te vṛṣabha vīryāṇi ||
Translation: What once thou didst in might when mortals vexed thee,—where now, O Bull, are those thy hero exploits?

Sanskit Text: तवं हि षमा चयावयन्नच्युतान्येको वर्त्रा चरसि जिघ्नमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hi ṣmā cyāvayannacyutānyeko vṛtrā carasi jighnamānaḥ |
Translation: 4 For, overthrowing what hath ne’er been shaken, thou goest forth alone destroying Vṛtras.

Sanskit Text: तव दयावाप्र्थिवी पर्वतासो.अनु वरताय निमितेव तस्थुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava dyāvāpṛthivī parvatāso.anu vratāya nimiteva tasthuḥ ||
Translation: For him who followeth thy Law the mountains and heaven and earth stand as if firmly stablished.

Sanskit Text: उताभये पुरुहूत शरवोभिरेको दर्ळ्हमवदो वर्त्रहा सन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: utābhaye puruhūta śravobhireko dṛḷhamavado vṛtrahā san |
Translation: 5 Yea, Much-invoked! in safety through thy glories alone thou speakest truth as Vṛtra's slayer.

Sanskit Text: इमे चिदिन्द्र रोदसी अपारे यत संग्र्भ्णा मघवन काशिरित ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime cidindra rodasī apāre yat saṃghṛbhṇā maghavan kāśirit te ||
Translation: E’en these two boundless worlds to thee, O Indra, what time thou graspest them, are but a handful.

Sanskit Text: पर सू त इन्द्र परवता हरिभ्यां पर ते वज्रः परम्र्णन्नेतु शत्रून |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sū ta indra pravatā haribhyāṃ pra te vajraḥ pramṛṇannetu śatrūn |
Translation: 6 Forthwith thy Bay steeds down the steep, O Indra, forth, crushing foemen, go thy bolt of thunder!

Sanskit Text: जहि परतीचो अनूचः पराचो विश्वं सत्यंक्र्णुहि विष्टमस्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jahi pratīco anūcaḥ parāco viśvaṃ satyaṃkṛṇuhi viṣṭamastu ||
Translation: Slay those who meet thee, those who flee, who follow: make all thy promise true; be all completed.

Sanskit Text: यस्मै धायुरदधा मर्त्यायाभक्तं चिद भजते गेह्यं सः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasmai dhāyuradadhā martyāyābhaktaṃ cid bhajate ghehyaṃ saḥ |
Translation: 7 The man to whom thou givest as Provider enjoys domestic plenty undivided.

Sanskit Text: भद्रा त इन्द्र सुमतिर्घ्र्ताची सहस्रदाना पुरुहूत रातिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadrā ta indra sumatirghṛtācī sahasradānā puruhūta rātiḥ ||
Translation: Blest, Indra, is thy favour dropping fatness: thy worship, Much-invoked! brings gifts in thousands.

Sanskit Text: सहदानुं पुरुहूत कषियन्तमहस्तमिन्द्र सं पिणक कुणारुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahadānuṃ puruhūta kṣiyantamahastamindra saṃ piṇak kuṇārum |
Translation: 8 Thou, Indra, Much-invoked! didst crush to pieces Kunaru handless fiend who dwelt with Danu.

Sanskit Text: अभि वर्त्रं वर्धमानं पियारुमपादमिन्द्र तवसा जघन्थ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi vṛtraṃ vardhamānaṃ piyārumapādamindra tavasā jaghantha ||
Translation: Thou with might, Indra, smotest dead the scorner, the footless Vṛtra as he waxed in vigour.

Sanskit Text: नि सामनामिषिरामिन्द्र भूमिं महीमपारां सदने ससत्थ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni sāmanāmiṣirāmindra bhūmiṃ mahīmapārāṃ sadane sasattha |
Translation: 9 Thou hast established in her seat, O Indra, the level earth, vast, vigorous, unbounded.

Sanskit Text: अस्तभ्नाद दयां वर्षभो अन्तरिक्षमर्षन्त्वापस्त्वयेह परसूताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: astabhnād dyāṃ vṛṣabho antarikṣamarṣantvāpastvayeha prasūtāḥ ||
Translation: The Bull hath propped the heaven and air's mid-region. By thee sent onward let the floods flow hither.

Sanskit Text: अलात्र्णो वल इन्द्र वरजो गोः पुरा हन्तोर्भयमानो वयार |
Sanskrit Transliteration: alātṛṇo vala indra vrajo ghoḥ purā hantorbhayamāno vyāra |
Translation: 10 He who withheld the kine, in silence I yielded in fear before thy blow, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: सुगान पथो अक्र्णोन निरजे गाः परावन वाणीः पुरुहूतं धमन्तीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sughān patho akṛṇon niraje ghāḥ prāvan vāṇīḥ puruhūtaṃ dhamantīḥ ||
Translation: He made paths easy to drive forth the cattle. Loud-breathing praises helped the Much-invoked One.

Sanskit Text: एको दवे वसुमती समीची इन्द्र आ पप्रौ पर्थिवीमुत दयाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eko dve vasumatī samīcī indra ā paprau pṛthivīmuta dyām |
Translation: 11 Indra alone filled full the earth and heaven, the Pair who meet together, rich in treasures.

Sanskit Text: उतान्तरिक्षादभि नः समीक इषो रथीः सयुजः शूर वाजान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utāntarikṣādabhi naḥ samīka iṣo rathīḥ sayujaḥ śūra vājān ||
Translation: Yea, bring thou near us from the air's mid-region strength, on thy car, and wholesome food, O Hero.

Sanskit Text: दिशः सूर्यो न मिनाति परदिष्टा दिवे-दिवे हर्यश्वप्रसूताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: diśaḥ sūryo na mināti pradiṣṭā dive-dive haryaśvaprasūtāḥ |
Translation: 12 Sūrya transgresses not the ordered limits set daily by the Lord of Tawny Coursers.

Sanskit Text: सं यदानळ अध्वन आदिदश्वैर्विमोचनं कर्णुते तत तवस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yadānaḷ adhvana ādidaśvairvimocanaṃ kṛṇute tat tvasya ||
Translation: When to the goal he comes, his journey ended, his Steeds he looses: this is Indra's doing.

Sanskit Text: दिद्र्क्षन्त उषसो यामन्नक्तोर्विवस्वत्या महि चित्रमनीकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: didṛkṣanta uṣaso yāmannaktorvivasvatyā mahi citramanīkam |
Translation: 13 Men gladly in the course of night would look on the broad bright front of the refulgent Morning;

Sanskit Text: विश्वे जानन्ति महिना यदागादिन्द्रस्य कर्म सुक्र्तापुरूणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve jānanti mahinā yadāghādindrasya karma sukṛtāpurūṇi ||
Translation: And all acknowledge, when she comes in glory, the manifold and goodly works of Indra.

Sanskit Text: महि जयोतिर्निहितं वक्षणास्वामा पक्वं चरति बिभ्रती गौः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahi jyotirnihitaṃ vakṣaṇāsvāmā pakvaṃ carati bibhratī ghauḥ |
Translation: 14 A mighty splendour rests upon her bosom: bearing ripe milk the Cow, unripe, advances.

Sanskit Text: विश्वं सवाद्म सम्भ्र्तमुस्रियायां यत सीमिन्द्रो अदधाद भोजनाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvaṃ svādma sambhṛtamusriyāyāṃ yat sīmindro adadhād bhojanāya ||
Translation: All sweetness is collected in the Heifer, sweetness which Indra made for our enjoyment.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र दर्ह्य यामकोशा अभूवन यज्ञाय शिक्ष गर्णते सखिभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra dṛhya yāmakośā abhūvan yajñāya śikṣa ghṛṇate sakhibhyaḥ |
Translation: 15 Barring the way they come. Be firm, O Indra; aid friends to sacrifice and him who singeth.

Sanskit Text: दुर्मायवो दुरेवा मर्त्यासो निषङगिणो रिपवो हन्त्वासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: durmāyavo durevā martyāso niṣaṅghiṇo ripavo hantvāsaḥ ||
Translation: These must be slain by thee, malignant mortals, armed with ill arts, our quiverbearing foemen.

Sanskit Text: सं घोषः शर्ण्वे.अवमैरमित्रैर्जही नयेष्वशनिं तपिष्ठाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ ghoṣaḥ śṛṇve.avamairamitrairjahī nyeṣvaśaniṃ tapiṣṭhām |
Translation: 16 A cry is beard from enemies most near us: against them send thy fiercest-flaming weapon.

Sanskit Text: वर्श्चेमधस्ताद वि रुजा सहस्व जहि रक्षो मघवन रन्धयस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛścemadhastād vi rujā sahasva jahi rakṣo maghavan randhayasva ||
Translation: Rend them from under, crush them and subdue them. Slay, Maghavan, and make the fiends our booty.

Sanskit Text: उद वर्ह रक्षः सहमूलमिन्द्र वर्श्चा मध्यं परत्यग्रंश्र्णीहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud vṛha rakṣaḥ sahamūlamindra vṛścā madhyaṃ pratyaghraṃśṛṇīhi |
Translation: 17 Root up the race of Rākṣasas, O Indra rend it in front and crush it in the middle.

Sanskit Text: आ कीवतः सललूकं चकर्थ बरह्मद्विषे तपुषिं हेतिमस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā kīvataḥ salalūkaṃ cakartha brahmadviṣe tapuṣiṃ hetimasya ||
Translation: How long hast thou bebaved as one who wavers? Cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion:

Sanskit Text: सवस्तये वाजिभिश्च परणेतः सं यन महीरिष आसत्सिपूर्वीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svastaye vājibhiśca praṇetaḥ saṃ yan mahīriṣa āsatsipūrvīḥ |
Translation: 18 When borne by strong Steeds for our weal, O Leader, thou seatest thee at many noble viands.

Sanskit Text: रायो वन्तारो बर्हतः सयामास्मे अस्तु भग इन्द्रप्रजावान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyo vantāro bṛhataḥ syāmāsme astu bhagha indraprajāvān ||
Translation: May we be winners of abundant riches. May Indra be our wealth with store of children.

Sanskit Text: आ नो भर भगमिन्द्र दयुमन्तं नि ते देष्णस्य धीमहि पररेके |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no bhara bhaghamindra dyumantaṃ ni te deṣṇasya dhīmahi prareke |
Translation: 19 Bestow on us resplendent wealth. O Indra let us enjoy thine overflow of bounty.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्व इव पप्रथे कामो अस्मे तमा पर्ण वसुपते वसूनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrva iva paprathe kāmo asme tamā pṛṇa vasupate vasūnām ||
Translation: Wide as a sea our longing hath expanded, fulfil it, O thou Treasure-Lord of treasures.

Sanskit Text: इमं कामं मन्दया गोभिरश्वैश्चन्द्रवता राधसा पप्रथश्च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ kāmaṃ mandayā ghobhiraśvaiścandravatā rādhasā paprathaśca |
Translation: 20 With kine and horses satisfy this longing with very splendid bounty skill extend it.

Sanskit Text: सवर्यवो मतिभिस्तुभ्यं विप्रा इन्द्राय वाहःकुशिकासो अक्रन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svaryavo matibhistubhyaṃ viprā indrāya vāhaḥkuśikāso akran ||
Translation: Seeking the light, with hymns to thee, O Indra, Kuśikas have brought their gift, the singers.

Sanskit Text: आ नो गोत्रा दर्द्र्हि गोपते गाः समस्मभ्यं सनयो यन्तु वाजाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no ghotrā dardṛhi ghopate ghāḥ samasmabhyaṃ sanayo yantu vājāḥ |
Translation: 21 Lord of the kine, burst the kine's stable open: cows shall be ours, and strength that wins the booty.

Sanskit Text: दिवक्षा असि वर्षभ सत्यशुष्मो.अस्मभ्यं सु मघवन बोधि गोदाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divakṣā asi vṛṣabha satyaśuṣmo.asmabhyaṃ su maghavan bodhi ghodāḥ ||
Translation: Hero, whose might is true, thy home is heaven: to us, O Maghavan, grant gifts of cattle.

Sanskit Text: शुनं हुवेम मघवानमिन्द्रमस्मिन भरे नर्तमं वाजसातौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śunaṃ huvema maghavānamindramasmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau |
Translation: 22 Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered,

Sanskit Text: शर्ण्वन्तमुग्रमूतये समत्सु घनन्तं वर्त्राणि संजितं धनानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇvantamughramūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām ||
Translation: The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vṛtras, wins and gathers riches.

Sanskit Text: पर पर्वतानामुशती उपस्थादश्वे इव विषिते हासमाने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra parvatānāmuśatī upasthādaśve iva viṣite hāsamāne |
Translation: 1. FORTH from the bosom of the mountains, eager as two swift mares with loosened rein contending,

Sanskit Text: गावेव शुभ्रे मातरा रिहाणे विपाट छुतुद्री पयसाजवेते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāveva śubhre mātarā rihāṇe vipāṭ chutudrī payasājavete ||
Translation: Like two bright mother cows who lick their youngling, Vipāś and Sutudri speed down their waters.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रेषिते परसवं भिक्षमाणे अछा समुद्रं रथ्येव याथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indreṣite prasavaṃ bhikṣamāṇe achā samudraṃ rathyeva yāthaḥ |
Translation: 2 Impelled by Indra whom ye pray to urge you, ye move as ’twere on chariots to the ocean.

Sanskit Text: समाराणे ऊर्मिभिः पिन्वमाने अन्या वामन्यामप्येति शुभ्रे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samārāṇe ūrmibhiḥ pinvamāne anyā vāmanyāmapyeti śubhre ||
Translation: Flowing together, swelling with your billows, O lucid Streams, each of you seeks the other.

Sanskit Text: अछा सिन्धुं मात्र्तमामयासं विपाशमुर्वीं सुभगामगन्म |
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā sindhuṃ mātṛtamāmayāsaṃ vipāśamurvīṃ subhaghāmaghanma |
Translation: 3 I have attained the most maternal River, we have approached Vipāś, the broad, the blessed.

Sanskit Text: वत्समिव मातरा संरिहाणे समानं योनिमनु संचरन्ती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vatsamiva mātarā saṃrihāṇe samānaṃ yonimanu saṃcarantī ||
Translation: Licking as ’twere their calf the pair of Mothers flow onward to their common home together.

Sanskit Text: एन वयं पयसा पिन्वमाना अनु योनिं देवक्र्तं चरन्तीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ena vayaṃ payasā pinvamānā anu yoniṃ devakṛtaṃ carantīḥ |
Translation: 4 We two who rise and swell with billowy waters move forward to the home which Gods have made us.

Sanskit Text: न वर्तवे परसवः सर्गतक्तः किंयुर्विप्रो नद्यो जोहवीति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na vartave prasavaḥ sarghataktaḥ kiṃyurvipro nadyo johavīti ||
Translation: Our flood may not be stayed when urged to motion. What would the singer, calling to the Rivers?

Sanskit Text: रमध्वं मे वचसे सोम्याय रतावरीरुप मुहूर्तमेवैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ramadhvaṃ me vacase somyāya ṛtāvarīrupa muhūrtamevaiḥ |
Translation: 5 Linger a little at my friendly bidding rest, Holy Ones, a moment in your journey.

Sanskit Text: पर सिन्धुमछा बर्हती मनीषावस्युरह्वे कुशिकस्य सूनुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sindhumachā bṛhatī manīṣāvasyurahve kuśikasya sūnuḥ ||
Translation: With hymn sublime soliciting your favour Kuśika's son hath called unto the River.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो अस्मानरदद वज्रबाहुरपाहन वर्त्रं परिधिं नदीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro asmānaradad vajrabāhurapāhan vṛtraṃ paridhiṃ nadīnām |
Translation: 6 Indra who wields the thunder dug our channels: he smote down Vṛtra, him who stayed our currents.

Sanskit Text: देवो.अनयत सवित सुपाणिस्तस्य वयं परसवे याम उर्वीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devo.anayat savita supāṇistasya vayaṃ prasave yāma urvīḥ ||
Translation: Savitar, God, the lovely-handed, led us, and at his sending forth we flow expanded.

Sanskit Text: परवाच्यं शश्वधा वीर्यं तदिन्द्रस्य कर्म यदहिंविव्र्श्चत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pravācyaṃ śaśvadhā vīryaṃ tadindrasya karma yadahiṃvivṛścat |
Translation: 7 That hero deed of Indra must be lauded for ever that he rent Ahi in pieces.

Sanskit Text: वि वज्रेण परिषदो जघानायन्नापो.अयनमिछमानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi vajreṇa pariṣado jaghānāyannāpo.ayanamichamānāḥ ||
Translation: He smote away the obstructors with his thunder, and eager for their course forth flowed the waters.

Sanskit Text: एतद वचो जरितर्मापि मर्ष्ठा आ यत ते घोषानुत्तरा युगानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etad vaco jaritarmāpi mṛṣṭhā ā yat te ghoṣānuttarā yughāni |
Translation: 8 Never forget this word of thine, O singer, which future generations shall reecho.

Sanskit Text: उक्थेषु कारो परति नो जुषस्व मा नो नि कः पुरुषत्रा नमस्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uktheṣu kāro prati no juṣasva mā no ni kaḥ puruṣatrā namaste ||
Translation: In hymns, O bard, show us thy loving kindness. Humble us not mid men. To thee be honour!

Sanskit Text: ओ षु सवसारः कारवे शर्णोत ययौ वो दूरादनसा रथेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: o ṣu svasāraḥ kārave śṛṇota yayau vo dūrādanasā rathena |
Translation: 9 List quickly, Sisters, to the bard who cometh to you from far away with car and wagon.

Sanskit Text: नि षू नमध्वं भवता सुपारा अधोक्षाः सिन्धवःस्रोत्याभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni ṣū namadhvaṃ bhavatā supārā adhoakṣāḥ sindhavaḥsrotyābhiḥ ||
Translation: Bow lowly down; be easy to be traversed stay, Rivers, with your floods below our axles.

Sanskit Text: आ ते कारो शर्णवामा वचांसि ययाथ दूरादनसा रथेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā te kāro śṛṇavāmā vacāṃsi yayātha dūrādanasā rathena |
Translation: 10 Yea, we will listen to thy words, O singer. With wain and car from far away thou comest.

Sanskit Text: नि ते नंसै पीप्यानेव योषा मर्यायेव कन्या शश्वचै ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni te naṃsai pīpyāneva yoṣā maryāyeva kanyā śaśvacai te ||
Translation: Low, like a nursing mother, will I bend me, and yield me as a maiden to her lover.

Sanskit Text: यदङग तवा भरताः सन्तरेयुर्गव्यन गराम इषित इन्द्रजूतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadaṅgha tvā bharatāḥ santareyurghavyan ghrāma iṣita indrajūtaḥ |
Translation: 11 Soon as the Bharatas have fared across thee, the warrior band, urged on and sped by Indra,

Sanskit Text: अर्षादह परसवः सर्गतक्त आ वो वर्णे सुमतिं यज्ञियानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arṣādaha prasavaḥ sarghatakta ā vo vṛṇe sumatiṃ yajñiyānām ||
Translation: Then let your streams flow on in rapid motion. I crave your favour who deserve our worship.

Sanskit Text: अतारिषुर्भरता गव्यवः समभक्त विप्रः सुमतिं नदीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atāriṣurbharatā ghavyavaḥ samabhakta vipraḥ sumatiṃ nadīnām |
Translation: 12 The warrior host, the Bharatas, fared over the singer won the favour of the Rivers.

Sanskit Text: पर पिन्वध्वमिषयन्तीः सुराधा आ वक्षणाः पर्णध्वं यात शीभम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra pinvadhvamiṣayantīḥ surādhā ā vakṣaṇāḥ pṛṇadhvaṃ yāta śībham ||
Translation: Swell with your billows, hasting, pouring riches. Fill full your channels, and roll swiftly onward.

Sanskit Text: उद व ऊर्मिः शम्या हन्त्वापो योक्त्राणि मुञ्चत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud va ūrmiḥ śamyā hantvāpo yoktrāṇi muñcata |
Translation: 13 So let your wave bear up the pins, and ye, O Waters, spare the thongs;

Sanskit Text: मादुष्क्र्तौ वयेनसाघ्न्यौ शूनमारताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: māduṣkṛtau vyenasāghnyau śūnamāratām ||
Translation: And never may the pair of Bulls, harmless and sinless, waste away.

Sanskit Text: वार्त्रहत्याय शवसे पर्तनाषाह्याय च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vārtrahatyāya śavase pṛtanāṣāhyāya ca |
Translation: 1. O INDRA, for the strength that slays Vṛtra and conquers in the fight,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र तवा वर्तयामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra tvā vartayāmasi ||
Translation: We turn thee hitherward to us.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाचीनं सु ते मन उत चक्षुः शतक्रतो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvācīnaṃ su te mana uta cakṣuḥ śatakrato |
Translation: 2 O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers, may those who praise thee hitherward.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र कर्ण्वन्तु वाघतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra kṛṇvantu vāghataḥ ||
Translation: Direct thy spirit and thine eye.

Sanskit Text: नामानि ते शतक्रतो विश्वाभिर्गीर्भिरीमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāmāni te śatakrato viśvābhirghīrbhirīmahe |
Translation: 3 O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers, with all our songs we invocate

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राभिमातिषाह्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrābhimātiṣāhye ||
Translation: Thy names for triumph over foes.

Sanskit Text: पुरुष्टुतस्य धामभिः शतेन महयामसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: puruṣṭutasya dhāmabhiḥ śatena mahayāmasi |
Translation: 4 We strive for glory through the powers immense of him whom many praise,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य चर्षणीध्र्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya carṣaṇīdhṛtaḥ ||
Translation: Of Indra who supports mankind.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं वर्त्राय हन्तवे पुरुहूतमुप बरुवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ vṛtrāya hantave puruhūtamupa bruve |
Translation: 5 For Vṛtra's slaughter I address Indra whom many invocate,

Sanskit Text: भरेषु वाजसातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhareṣu vājasātaye ||
Translation: To win us booty in the wars.

Sanskit Text: वाजेषु सासहिर्भव तवामीमहे शतक्रतो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājeṣu sāsahirbhava tvāmīmahe śatakrato |
Translation: 6 In battles be victorious. We seek thee, Lord of Hundred Powers,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र वर्त्रायहन्तवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra vṛtrāyahantave ||
Translation: Indra, that Vṛtra may be slain.

Sanskit Text: दयुम्नेषु पर्तनाज्ये पर्त्सुतूर्षु शरवस्सु च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyumneṣu pṛtanājye pṛtsutūrṣu śravassu ca |
Translation: 7 In splendid combats of the hosts, in glories where the fight is won.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र साक्ष्वाभिमातिषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra sākṣvābhimātiṣu ||
Translation: Indra, be victor over foes.

Sanskit Text: शुष्मिन्तमं न ऊतये दयुम्निनं पाहि जाग्र्विम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuṣmintamaṃ na ūtaye dyumninaṃ pāhi jāghṛvim |
Translation: 8 Drink thou the Soma for our help, bright, vigilant, exceeding strong,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र सोमंशतक्रतो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra somaṃśatakrato ||
Translation: O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रियाणि शतक्रतो या ते जनेषु पञ्चसु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indriyāṇi śatakrato yā te janeṣu pañcasu |
Translation: 9 O Śatakratu, powers which thou mid the Five Races hast displayed-

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र तानि ता वर्णे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra tāni taā vṛṇe ||
Translation: These, Indra, do I claim of thee.

Sanskit Text: अगन्निन्द्र शरवो बर्हद दयुम्नं दधिष्व दुष्टरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghannindra śravo bṛhad dyumnaṃ dadhiṣva duṣṭaram |
Translation: 10 Indra, great glory hast thou gained. Win splendid fame which none may mar

Sanskit Text: उत ते शुष्मं तिरामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut te śuṣmaṃ tirāmasi ||
Translation: We make thy might perpetual.

Sanskit Text: अर्वावतो न आ गह्यथो शक्र परावतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāvato na ā ghahyatho śakra parāvataḥ |
Translation: 11 Come to us either from anear, Or, Śakra, come from far away.

Sanskit Text: उ लोको यस्ते अद्रिव इन्द्रेह तत आ गहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: u loko yaste adriva indreha tata ā ghahi ||
Translation: Indra, wherever be thy home, come to us thence, O Thunder-armed.

Sanskit Text: आ तू न इन्द्र मद्र्यग घुवानः सोमपीतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tū na indra madryagh ghuvānaḥ somapītaye |
Translation: 1. INVOKED to drink the Soma juice, come with thy Bay Steeds, Thunder-armed

Sanskit Text: हरिभ्यां याह्यद्रिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: haribhyāṃ yāhyadrivaḥ ||
Translation: Come, Indra, hitherward to me.

Sanskit Text: सत्तो होता न रत्वियस्तिस्तिरे बर्हिरानुषक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satto hotā na ṛtviyastistire barhirānuṣak |
Translation: 2 Our priest is seated, true to time; the grass is regularly strewn;

Sanskit Text: अयुज्रन परातरद्रयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayujran prātaradrayaḥ ||
Translation: The pressing-stones were set at morn.

Sanskit Text: इमा बरह्म बरह्मवाहः करियन्त आ बर्हिः सीद |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā brahma brahmavāhaḥ kriyanta ā barhiḥ sīda |
Translation: 3 These prayers, O thou who hearest prayer are offered: seat thee on the grass.

Sanskit Text: वीहि शूर पुरोळाशम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vīhi śūra puroḷāśam ||
Translation: Hero, enjoy the offered cake.

Sanskit Text: रारन्धि सवनेषु ण एषु सतोमेषु वर्त्रहन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rārandhi savaneṣu ṇa eṣu stomeṣu vṛtrahan |
Translation: 4 O Vṛtra-slayer, be thou pleased with these libations, with these hymns,

Sanskit Text: उक्थेष्विन्द्र गिर्वणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uktheṣvindra ghirvaṇaḥ ||
Translation: Song-loving Indra, with our lauds.

Sanskit Text: मतयः सोमपामुरुं रिहन्ति शवसस पतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: matayaḥ somapāmuruṃ rihanti śavasas patim |
Translation: 5 Our hymns caress the Lord of Strength, vast, drinker of the Soma's juice,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं वत्सं न मातरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ vatsaṃ na mātaraḥ ||
Translation: Indra, as mother-cows their calf.

Sanskit Text: स मन्दस्वा हयन्धसो राधसे तन्वा महे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa mandasvā hyandhaso rādhase tanvā mahe |
Translation: 6 Delight thee with the juice we pour for thine own great munificence:

Sanskit Text: न सतोतारं निदे करः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na stotāraṃ nide karaḥ ||
Translation: Yield not thy singer to reproach.

Sanskit Text: वयमिन्द्र तवायवो हविष्मन्तो जरामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayamindra tvāyavo haviṣmanto jarāmahe |
Translation: 7 We, Indra, dearly loving thee, bearing oblation, sing thee hymns

Sanskit Text: उत तवमस्मयुर्वसो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tvamasmayurvaso ||
Translation: Thou, Vasu, dearly lovest us.

Sanskit Text: मारे अस्मद वि मुमुचो हरिप्रियार्वां याहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: māre asmad vi mumuco haripriyārvāṃ yāhi |
Translation: 8 O thou to whom thy Bays are dear, loose not thy Horses far from us:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र सवधावोमत्स्वेह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra svadhāvomatsveha ||
Translation: Here glad thee, Indra, Lord divine.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाञ्चं तवा सुखे रथे वहतामिन्द्र केशिना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāñcaṃ tvā sukhe rathe vahatāmindra keśinā |
Translation: 9 May long-maned Coursers, dropping oil, bring thee on swift car hitherward,

Sanskit Text: घर्तस्नूबर्हिरासदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtasnūbarhirāsade ||
Translation: Indra, to seat thee on the grass.

Sanskit Text: उप नः सुतमा गहि सोममिन्द्र गवाशिरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa naḥ sutamā ghahi somamindra ghavāśiram |
Translation: 1. COME to the juice that we have pressed, to Soma, Indra, bleat with milk:

Sanskit Text: हरिभ्यां यस्ते अस्मयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: haribhyāṃ yaste asmayuḥ ||
Translation: Come, favouring us, thy Bay-drawn car!

Sanskit Text: तमिन्द्र मदमा गहि बर्हिष्ठां गरावभिः सुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamindra madamā ghahi barhiṣṭhāṃ ghrāvabhiḥ sutam |
Translation: 2 Come, Indra, to this gladdening drink, placed on the grass, pressed out with stones:

Sanskit Text: कुविन नवस्य तर्प्णवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvin nvasya tṛpṇavaḥ ||
Translation: Wilt thou not drink thy fill thereof?

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रमित्था गिरो ममाछागुरिषिता इतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indramitthā ghiro mamāchāghuriṣitā itaḥ |
Translation: 3 To Indra have my songs of praise gone forth, thus rapidly sent hence,

Sanskit Text: आव्र्ते सोमपीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvṛte somapītaye ||
Translation: To turn him to the Soma-draught.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं सोमस्य पीतये सतोमैरिह हवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ somasya pītaye stomairiha havāmahe |
Translation: 4 Hither with songs of praise we call Indra to drink the Soma juice:

Sanskit Text: उक्थेभिः कुविदागमत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukthebhiḥ kuvidāghamat ||
Translation: Will he not come to us by lauds?

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र सोमाः सुता इमे तान दधिष्व शतक्रतो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra somāḥ sutā ime tān dadhiṣva śatakrato |
Translation: 5 Indra, these Somas are expressed. Take them within thy belly, Lord

Sanskit Text: जठरे वाजिनीवसो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jaṭhare vājinīvaso ||
Translation: Of Hundred Powers, thou Prince of Wealth.

Sanskit Text: विद्मा हि तवा धनंजयं वाजेषु दध्र्षं कवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidmā hi tvā dhanaṃjayaṃ vājeṣu dadhṛṣaṃ kave |
Translation: 6 We know thee winner of the spoil, and resolute in battles, Sage!

Sanskit Text: अधा तेसुम्नमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā tesumnamīmahe ||
Translation: Therefore thy blessing we implore.

Sanskit Text: इममिन्द्र गवाशिरं यवाशिरं च नः पिब |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imamindra ghavāśiraṃ yavāśiraṃ ca naḥ piba |
Translation: 7 Borne hither by thy Stallions, drink, Indra, this juice which we have pressed,

Sanskit Text: आगत्या वर्षभिः सुतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āghatyā vṛṣabhiḥ sutam ||
Translation: Mingled with barley and with milk.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्येदिन्द्र सव ओक्ये सोमं चोदामि पीतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyedindra sva okye somaṃ codāmi pītaye |
Translation: 8 Indra, for thee, in thine own place, I urge the Soma for thy draught:

Sanskit Text: एष रारन्तु ते हर्दि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa rārantu te hṛdi ||
Translation: Deep in thy heart let it remain,

Sanskit Text: तवां सुतस्य पीतये परत्नमिन्द्र हवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ sutasya pītaye pratnamindra havāmahe |
Translation: 9 We call on thee, the Ancient One, Indra, to drink the Soma juice,

Sanskit Text: कुशिकासो अवस्यवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kuśikāso avasyavaḥ ||
Translation: We Kuśikas who seek thine aid.

Sanskit Text: अयं ते अस्तु हर्यतः सोम आ हरिभिः सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ te astu haryataḥ soma ā haribhiḥ sutaḥ |
Translation: 1. May this delightsome Soma be expressed for thee by tawny stones.

Sanskit Text: जुषाण इन्द्र हरिभिर्न आ गह्या तिष्ठ हरितं रथम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣāṇa indra haribhirna ā ghahyā tiṣṭha haritaṃ ratham ||
Translation: Joying thereat, O Indra, with thy Bay Steeds come:. ascend thy golden-coloured car.

Sanskit Text: हर्यन्नुषसमर्चयः सूर्यं हर्यन्नरोचयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: haryannuṣasamarcayaḥ sūryaṃ haryannarocayaḥ |
Translation: 2 In love thou madest Uṣas glow, in love thou madest Sūrya shine.

Sanskit Text: विद्वांष्चिकित्वान हर्यश्व वर्धस इन्द्र विश्वा अभि शरियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidvāṃṣcikitvān haryaśva vardhasa indra viśvā abhi śriyaḥ ||
Translation: Thou, Indra, knowing, thinking, Lord of Tawny Steeds, above all glories waxest great.

Sanskit Text: दयामिन्द्रो हरिधायसं पर्थिवीं हरिवर्पसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyāmindro haridhāyasaṃ pṛthivīṃ harivarpasam |
Translation: 3 The heaven with streams of golden hue, earth with her tints of green and gold-

Sanskit Text: अधारयद धरितोर्भूरि भोजनं ययोरन्तर्हरिश्चरत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhārayad dharitorbhūri bhojanaṃ yayorantarhariścarat ||
Translation: The golden Pair yield Indra plenteous nourishment: between them moves the golden One.

Sanskit Text: जज्ञानो हरितो वर्षा विश्वमा भाति रोचनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jajñāno harito vṛṣā viśvamā bhāti rocanam |
Translation: 4 When born to life the golden Bull illumines all the realm of light.

Sanskit Text: हर्यश्वो हरितं धत्त आयुधमा वज्रं बाह्वोर्हरिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: haryaśvo haritaṃ dhatta āyudhamā vajraṃ bāhvorharim ||
Translation: He takes his golden weapon, Lord of Tawny Steeds, the golden thunder in his arms.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो हर्यन्तमर्जुनं वज्रं शुक्रैरभीव्र्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro haryantamarjunaṃ vajraṃ śukrairabhīvṛtam |
Translation: 5 The bright, the well-loved thunderbolt, girt with the bright, Indra disclosed,

Sanskit Text: अपाव्र्णोद धरिभिरद्रिभिः सुतमुद गा हरिभिराजत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāvṛṇod dharibhiradribhiḥ sutamud ghā haribhirājata ||
Translation: Disclosed the Soma juice pressed out by tawny stones, with tawny steeds drave forth the kine.

Sanskit Text: आ मन्द्रैरिन्द्र हरिभिर्याहि मयूररोमभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā mandrairindra haribhiryāhi mayūraromabhiḥ |
Translation: 1. COME hither, Indra, with Bay Steeds, joyous, with tails like peacocks' plumes.

Sanskit Text: मा तवा केचिन नि यमन विं न पाशिनो.अति धन्वेव तानिहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā tvā kecin ni yaman viṃ na pāśino.ati dhanveva tānihi ||
Translation: Let no men cheek thy course as fowlers stay the bird: pass o’er them as o’er desert lands.

Sanskit Text: वर्त्रखादो वलंरुजः पुरां दर्मो अपामजः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛtrakhādo valaṃrujaḥ purāṃ darmo apāmajaḥ |
Translation: 2 He who slew Vṛtra, burst the cloud, brake the strongholds and drave the floods,

Sanskit Text: सथाता रथस्य हर्योरभिस्वर इन्द्रो दर्ळ्हा चिदारुजः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sthātā rathasya haryorabhisvara indro dṛḷhā cidārujaḥ ||
Translation: Indra who mounts his chariot at his Bay Steeds' cry, shatters e’en things that stand most firm.

Sanskit Text: गम्भीरानुदधीन्रिव करतुं पुष्यसि गा इव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghambhīrānudadhīnriva kratuṃ puṣyasi ghā iva |
Translation: 3 Like pools of water deep and full, like kine thou cherishest thy might;

Sanskit Text: पर सुगोपायवसं धेनवो यथा हरदं कुल्या इवाशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sughopāyavasaṃ dhenavo yathā hradaṃ kulyā ivāśata ||
Translation: Like the milch-cows that go well-guarded to the mead, like water-brooks that reach the lake.

Sanskit Text: आ नस्तुजं रयिं भरांशं न परतिजानते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā nastujaṃ rayiṃ bharāṃśaṃ na pratijānate |
Translation: 4 Bring thou us wealth with power to strike, our share, 'gainst him who calls it his.

Sanskit Text: वर्क्षं पक्वं फलमङकीव धूनुहीन्द्र सम्पारणं वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛkṣaṃ pakvaṃ phalamaṅkīva dhūnuhīndra sampāraṇaṃ vasu ||
Translation: Shake, Indra, as with hooks, the tree for ripened fruit, for wealth to satisfy our wish.

Sanskit Text: सवयुरिन्द्र सवराळ असि समद्दिष्टिः सवयशस्तरः |
