Sanskrit Transliteration: svayurindra svarāḷ asi smaddiṣṭiḥ svayaśastaraḥ |
Translation: 5 Indra, self-ruling Lord art thou, good Leader, of most glorious fame.

Sanskit Text: स वाव्र्धान ओजसा पुरुष्टुत भवा नः सुश्रवस्तमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vāvṛdhāna ojasā puruṣṭuta bhavā naḥ suśravastamaḥ ||
Translation: So, waxen in thy strength, O thou whom many praise, be thou most swift to hear our call.

Sanskit Text: युध्मस्य ते वर्षभस्य सवराज उग्रस्य यून सथविरस्य घर्ष्वेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yudhmasya te vṛṣabhasya svarāja ughrasya yūna sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ |
Translation: 1. OF thee, the Bull, the Warrior, Sovran Ruler, joyous and fierce, ancient and ever youthful,

Sanskit Text: अजूर्यतो वज्रिणो वीर्याणीन्द्र शरुतस्य महतो महानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajūryato vajriṇo vīryāṇīndra śrutasya mahato mahāni ||
Translation: The undecaying One who wields the thunder, renowned and great, great are the exploits, Indra.

Sanskit Text: महानसि महिष वर्ष्ण्येभिर्धनस्प्र्दुग्र सहमानो अन्यान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahānasi mahiṣa vṛṣṇyebhirdhanaspṛdughra sahamāno anyān |
Translation: 2 Great art thou, Mighty Lord, through manly vigour, O fierce One, gathering spoil, subduing others,

Sanskit Text: एको विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा स योधया च कषयया च जनान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eko viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā sa yodhayā ca kṣayayā ca janān ||
Translation: Thyself alone the universe's Sovran: so send forth men to combat and to rest them.

Sanskit Text: पर मात्राभी रिरिचे रोचमानः पर देवेभिर्विश्वतो अप्रतीतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra mātrābhī ririce rocamānaḥ pra devebhirviśvato apratītaḥ |
Translation: 3 He hath surpassed all measure in his brightness, yea, and the Gods, for none may be his equal.

Sanskit Text: पर मज्मना दिव इन्द्रः पर्थिव्याः परोरोर्महो अन्तरिक्षाद रजीषी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra majmanā diva indraḥ pṛthivyāḥ prorormaho antarikṣād ṛjīṣī ||
Translation: Impetuous Indra in his might cxccedcth wide vast mid-air and heaven and earth together.

Sanskit Text: उरुं गभीरं जनुषाभ्युग्रं विश्वव्यचसमवतं मतीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uruṃ ghabhīraṃ januṣābhyughraṃ viśvavyacasamavataṃ matīnām |
Translation: 4 To Indra, even as rivers to the ocean, flow forth from days of old the Soma juices;

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं सोमासः परदिवि सुतासः समुद्रं न सरवता विशन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ somāsaḥ pradivi sutāsaḥ samudraṃ na sravataā viśanti ||
Translation: To him wide deep and mighty from his birth-time, the well of holy thoughts, aIl-comprehending.

Sanskit Text: यं सोममिन्द्र पर्थिवीद्यावा गर्भं न माता बिभ्र्तस्त्वाया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ somamindra pṛthivīdyāvā gharbhaṃ na mātā bibhṛtastvāyā |
Translation: 5 The Soma, Indra, which the earth and heaven bear for thee as a mother bears her infant,

Sanskit Text: तं ते हिन्वन्ति तमु ते मर्जन्त्यध्वर्यवो वर्षभ पातवा उ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ te hinvanti tamu te mṛjantyadhvaryavo vṛṣabha pātavā u ||
Translation: This they send forth to thee, this, vigorous Hero! Adhvaryus purify for thee to drink of.

Sanskit Text: मरुत्वानिन्द्र वर्षभो रणाय पिबा सोममनुष्वधं मदाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: marutvānindra vṛṣabho raṇāya pibā somamanuṣvadhaṃ madāya |
Translation: 1. DRINK, Indra, Marut-girt, as Bull, the Soma, for joy, for rapture even as thou listest.

Sanskit Text: आ सिञ्चस्व जठरे मध्व ऊर्मिं तवं राजासि परदिवः सुतानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā siñcasva jaṭhare madhva ūrmiṃ tvaṃ rājāsi pradivaḥ sutānām ||
Translation: Pour down the flood of meath within thy belly: thou from of old art King of Soma juices.

Sanskit Text: सजोषा इन्द्र सगणो मरुद्भिः सोमं पिब वर्त्रहा शूर विद्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣā indra saghaṇo marudbhiḥ somaṃ piba vṛtrahā śūra vidvān |
Translation: 2 Indra, accordant, with the banded Maruts, drink Soma, Hero, as wise Vṛtra-slayer.

Sanskit Text: जहि शत्रून्रप मर्धो नुदस्वाथाभयं कर्णुहि विश्वतो नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jahi śatrūnrapa mṛdho nudasvāthābhayaṃ kṛṇuhi viśvato naḥ ||
Translation: Slay thou our foemen, drive away assailants and make us safe on every side from danger.

Sanskit Text: उत रतुभिर्र्तुपाः पाहि सोममिन्द्र देवेभिः सखिभिः सुतं नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta ṛtubhirṛtupāḥ pāhi somamindra devebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ sutaṃ naḥ |
Translation: 3 And, drinker at due seasons, drink in season, Indra, with friendly Gods, our pressed-out Soma.

Sanskit Text: यानाभजो मरुतो ये तवान्वहन वर्त्रमदधुस्तुभ्यमोजः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yānābhajo maruto ye tvānvahan vṛtramadadhustubhyamojaḥ ||
Translation: The Maruts following, whom thou madest sharers, gave thee the victory, and thou slewest Vṛtra.

Sanskit Text: ये तवाहिहत्ये मघवन्नवर्धन ये शाम्बरे हरिवो ये गविष्टौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye tvāhihatye maghavannavardhan ye śāmbare harivo ye ghaviṣṭau |
Translation: 4 Drink Soma, Indra, banded with the Maruts who, Maghavan, strengthened thee at Ahi's slaughter,

Sanskit Text: ये तवा नूनमनुमदन्ति विप्राः पिबेन्द्र सोमं सगणो मरुद्भिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye tvā nūnamanumadanti viprāḥ pibendra somaṃ saghaṇo marudbhiḥ ||
Translation: 'Gainst Śambara, Lord of Bays! in winning cattle, and now rejoice in thee, the holy Singers.

Sanskit Text: मरुत्वन्तं वर्षभं वाव्र्धानमकवारिं दिव्यं शासमिन्द्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: marutvantaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ vāvṛdhānamakavāriṃ divyaṃ śāsamindram |
Translation: 5 The Bull whose strength hath waxed, whom Maruts follow, free-giving Indra, the celestial Ruler,

Sanskit Text: विश्वासाहमवसे नूतनायोग्रं सहोदामिह तंहुवेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāsāhamavase nūtanāyoghraṃ sahodāmiha taṃhuvema ||
Translation: Mighty, all-conquering, the victory-giver, him let us call to grant us new protection.

Sanskit Text: चर्षणीध्र्तं मघवानमुक्थ्यमिन्द्रं गिरो बर्हतीरभ्यनूषत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: carṣaṇīdhṛtaṃ maghavānamukthyamindraṃ ghiro bṛhatīrabhyanūṣata |
Translation: 1. HIGH hymns have sounded forth the praise of Maghavan, supporter of mankind, of Indra meet for lauds;

Sanskit Text: वाव्र्धानं पुरुहूतं सुव्र्क्तिभिरमर्त्यं जरमाणं दिवे-दिवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāvṛdhānaṃ puruhūtaṃ suvṛktibhiramartyaṃ jaramāṇaṃ dive-dive ||
Translation: Him who hath waxen great, invoked with beauteous songs, Immortal One, whose praise each day is sung aloud.

Sanskit Text: शतक्रतुमर्णवं शाकिनं नरं गिरो म इन्द्रमुप यन्ति विश्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śatakratumarṇavaṃ śākinaṃ naraṃ ghiro ma indramupa yanti viśvataḥ |
Translation: 2 To Indra from all sides go forth my songs of praise, the Lord of Hundred Powers, strong, Hero, like the sea,

Sanskit Text: वाजसनिं पूर्भिदं तूर्णिमप्तुरं धामसाचमभिषाचं सवर्विदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājasaniṃ pūrbhidaṃ tūrṇimapturaṃ dhāmasācamabhiṣācaṃ svarvidam ||
Translation: Swift, winner of the booty, breaker-down of forts, faithful and ever-glorious, finder of the light.

Sanskit Text: आकरे वसोर्जरिता पनस्यते.अनेहस सतुभ इन्द्रो दुवस्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ākare vasorjaritā panasyate.anehasa stubha indro duvasyati |
Translation: 3 Where battle's spoil is piled the singer winneth praise, for Indra taketh care of matchless worshippers.

Sanskit Text: विवस्वतः सदन आ हि पिप्रिये सत्रासाहमभिमातिहनं सतुहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vivasvataḥ sadana ā hi pipriye satrāsāhamabhimātihanaṃ stuhi ||
Translation: He in Vivasvān's dwelling findeth his delight: praise thou the ever-conquering slayer of the foe.

Sanskit Text: नर्णामु तवा नर्तमं गीर्भिरुक्थैरभि पर वीरमर्चता सबाधः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛṇāmu tvā nṛtamaṃ ghīrbhirukthairabhi pra vīramarcatā sabādhaḥ |
Translation: 4 Thee, valorous, most heroic of the heroes, shall the priests glorify with songg and praises.

Sanskit Text: सं सहसे पुरुमायो जिहीते नमो अस्य परदिव एक ईशे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ sahase purumāyo jihīte namo asya pradiva eka īśe ||
Translation: Full of all wondrous power he goes to conquest: worship is his, sole Lord from days aforetime.

Sanskit Text: पूर्वीरस्य निष्षिधो मर्त्येषु पुरू वसूनि पर्थिवी बिभर्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvīrasya niṣṣidho martyeṣu purū vasūni pṛthivī bibharti |
Translation: 5 Abundant are the gifts he gives to mortals: for him the earth bears a rich store of treasures.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय दयाव ओषधीरुतापो रयिं रक्षन्ति जीरयो वनानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya dyāva oṣadhīrutāpo rayiṃ rakṣanti jīrayo vanāni ||
Translation: The heavens, the growing plants, the living waters, the forest trees preserve their wealth for Indra.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्यं बरह्माणि गिर इन्द्र तुभ्यं सत्रा दधिरे हरिवो जुषस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyaṃ brahmāṇi ghira indra tubhyaṃ satrā dadhire harivo juṣasva |
Translation: 6 To thee, O Indra, Lord of Bays, for ever are offered prayers and songs: accept them gladly.

Sanskit Text: बोध्यापिरवसो नूतनस्य सखे वसो जरित्र्भ्यो वयोधाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bodhyāpiravaso nūtanasya sakhe vaso jaritṛbhyo vayodhāḥ ||
Translation: As Kinsman think thou of some fresh assistance; good Friend, give strength and life to those who praise thee.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र मरुत्व इह पाहि सोमं यथा शार्याते अपिबः सुतस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra marutva iha pāhi somaṃ yathā śāryāte apibaḥ sutasya |
Translation: 7 Here, Indra, drink thou Soma with the Maruts, as thou didst drink the juice beside Śāryāta.

Sanskit Text: तव परणीती तव शूर शर्मन्ना विवासन्ति कवयःसुयज्ञाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava praṇītī tava śūra śarmannā vivāsanti kavayaḥsuyajñāḥ ||
Translation: Under thy guidance, in thy keeping, Hero, the singers serve, skilled in fair sacrifices.

Sanskit Text: स वावशान इह पाहि सोमं मरुद्भिरिन्द्र सखिभिः सुतं नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vāvaśāna iha pāhi somaṃ marudbhirindra sakhibhiḥ sutaṃ naḥ |
Translation: 8 So eagerly desirous drink the Soma, our juice, O Indra, with thy friends the Maruts,

Sanskit Text: जातं यत तवा परि देवा अभूषन महे भराय पुरुहूत विश्वे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jātaṃ yat tvā pari devā abhūṣan mahe bharāya puruhūta viśve ||
Translation: Since at thy birth all Deities adorned thee for the great fight, O thou invoked of many.

Sanskit Text: अप्तूर्ये मरुत आपिरेषो.अमन्दन्निन्द्रमनु दातिवाराः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aptūrye maruta āpireṣo.amandannindramanu dātivārāḥ |
Translation: 9 He was your comrade in your zeal, O Maruts: they, rich in noble gifts, rejoiced in Indra.

Sanskit Text: तेभिः साकं पिबतु वर्त्रखादः सुतं सोमं दाशुषः सवे सधस्थे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tebhiḥ sākaṃ pibatu vṛtrakhādaḥ sutaṃ somaṃ dāśuṣaḥ sve sadhasthe ||
Translation: With them together let the Vṛtra-slayer drink in his home the worshipper's libation.

Sanskit Text: इदं हयन्वोजसा सुतं राधानां पते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ hyanvojasā sutaṃ rādhānāṃ pate |
Translation: 10 So, Lord of affluent gifts, this juice hath been pressed for thee with strength

Sanskit Text: पिबा तवस्य गिर्वणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibā tvasya ghirvaṇaḥ ||
Translation: Drink of it, thou who lovest song.

Sanskit Text: यस्ते अनु सवधामसत सुते नि यछ तन्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaste anu svadhāmasat sute ni yacha tanvam |
Translation: 11 Incline thy body to this juice which suits thy Godlike nature well:

Sanskit Text: स तवा ममत्तु सोम्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvā mamattu somyam ||
Translation: May it cheer thee who lovest it.

Sanskit Text: पर ते अश्नोतु कुक्ष्योः परेन्द्र बरह्मणा शिरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te aśnotu kukṣyoḥ prendra brahmaṇā śiraḥ |
Translation: 12 Brave Indra, let it work through both thy flanks, and through thy head by prayer,

Sanskit Text: पर बाहू शूर राधसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra bāhū śūra rādhase ||
Translation: And through thine arms, to prosper us.

Sanskit Text: इमं महे विदथ्याय शूषं शश्वत कर्त्व ईड्यय पर जभ्रुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ mahe vidathyāya śūṣaṃ śaśvat kṛtva īḍyaya pra jabhruḥ |
Translation: 1. To him adorable, mighty, meet for synods, this strengthening hymn, unceasing, have they offered.

Sanskit Text: शर्णोतु नो दम्येभिरनीकैः शर्णोत्वग्निर्दिव्यैरजस्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇotu no damyebhiranīkaiḥ śṛṇotvaghnirdivyairajasraḥ ||
Translation: May Agni hear us with his homely splendours, hear us, Eternal One, with heavenly lustre.

Sanskit Text: महि महे दिवे अर्चा पर्थिव्यै कामो म इछञ्चरति परजानन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahi mahe dive arcā pṛthivyai kāmo ma ichañcarati prajānan |
Translation: 2 To mighty Heaven and Earth I sing forth loudly: my wish goes out desirous and well knowing

Sanskit Text: ययोर्ह सतोमे विदथेषु देवाः सपर्यवो मादयन्ते सचायोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayorha stome vidatheṣu devāḥ saparyavo mādayante sacāyoḥ ||
Translation: Both, at whose laud in synods, showing favour, the Gods rejoice them with the living mortal.

Sanskit Text: युवोर्र्तं रोदसी सत्यमस्तु महे षु णः सुविताय पर भूतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvorṛtaṃ rodasī satyamastu mahe ṣu ṇaḥ suvitāya pra bhūtam |
Translation: 3 O Heaven and Earth, may your great law he faithful: he ye our leaders for our high advantage.

Sanskit Text: इदं दिवे नमो अग्ने पर्थिव्यै सपर्यामि परयसा यामि रत्नम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ dive namo aghne pṛthivyai saparyāmi prayasā yāmi ratnam ||
Translation: To Heaven and Earth I offer this my homage, with food, O Agni, as I pray for riches.

Sanskit Text: उतो हि वां पूर्व्या आविविद्र रतावरी रोदसी सत्यवाचः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto hi vāṃ pūrvyā āvividra ṛtāvarī rodasī satyavācaḥ |
Translation: 4 Yea, holy Heaven and Earth, the ancient sages whose word was ever true had power to find you;

Sanskit Text: नरश्चिद वां समिथे शूरसातौ ववन्दिरे पर्थिवि वेविदानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: naraścid vāṃ samithe śūrasātau vavandire pṛthivi vevidānāḥ ||
Translation: And brave men in the fightwhere heroes conquer, O Earth, have known you well and paid you honour.

Sanskit Text: को अद्धा वेद क इह पर वोचद देवानछा पथ्या का समेति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko addhā veda ka iha pra vocad devānachā pathyā kā sameti |
Translation: 5 What pathway leadeth to the Gods? Who knoweth this of a truth, and who will now declare it?

Sanskit Text: दद्र्श्र एषामवमा सदांसि परेषु या गुह्येषु वरतेषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadṛśra eṣāmavamā sadāṃsi pareṣu yā ghuhyeṣu vrateṣu ||
Translation: Seen are their lowest dwelling-places only, but they are in remote and secret regions.

Sanskit Text: कविर्न्र्चक्षा अभि षीमचष्ट रतस्य योना विघ्र्ते मदन्ती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kavirnṛcakṣā abhi ṣīmacaṣṭa ṛtasya yonā vighṛte madantī |
Translation: 6 The Sage who looketh on mankind hath viewed them bedewed, rejoicing in the seat of Order.

Sanskit Text: नाना चक्राते सदनं यथा वः समानेन करतुना संविदाने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nānā cakrāte sadanaṃ yathā vaḥ samānena kratunā saṃvidāne ||
Translation: They make a home as for a bird, though parted, with one same will finding themselves together.

Sanskit Text: समान्या वियुते दूरेन्ते धरुवे पदे तस्थतुर्जागरूके |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samānyā viyute dūreante dhruve pade tasthaturjāgharūke |
Translation: 7 Partners though parted, with far-distant limits, on one firm place both stand for ever watchful,

Sanskit Text: उत सवसारा युवती भवन्ती आदु बरुवाते मिथुनानि नाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta svasārā yuvatī bhavantī ādu bruvāte mithunāni nāma ||
Translation: And, being young for evermore, as sisters, speak to each other names that are united.

Sanskit Text: विश्वेदेते जनिमा सं विविक्तो महो देवान बिभ्रती न वयथेते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvedete janimā saṃ vivikto maho devān bibhratī na vyathete |
Translation: 8 All living things they part and keep asunder; though bearing up the mighty Gods they reel not.

Sanskit Text: एजद धरुवं पत्यते विश्वमेकं चरत पतत्रि विषुणं वि जातम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ejad dhruvaṃ patyate viśvamekaṃ carat patatri viṣuṇaṃ vi jātam ||
Translation: One All is Lord of what is fixed and moving, that walks, that flies, this multiform creation.

Sanskit Text: सना पुराणमध्येम्यारान महः पितुर्जनितुर्जामि तन नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanā purāṇamadhyemyārān mahaḥ piturjaniturjāmi tan naḥ |
Translation: 9 Afar the Ancient from of old I ponder, our kinship with our mighty Sire and Father,—

Sanskit Text: देवासो यत्र पनितार एवैरुरौ पथि वयुते तस्थुरन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāso yatra panitāra evairurau pathi vyute tasthurantaḥ ||
Translation: Singing the praise whereof the Gods by custom stand on the spacious far-extended pathway.

Sanskit Text: इमं सतोमं रोदसी पर बरवीम्य रदूदराः शर्णवन्नग्निजिह्वाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ stomaṃ rodasī pra bravīmy ṛdūdarāḥ śṛṇavannaghnijihvāḥ |
Translation: 10 This laud, O Heaven and Earth, to you I utter: let the kind-hearted hear, whose tongue is Agni,

Sanskit Text: मित्रः सम्राजो वरुणो युवान आदित्यासः कवयः पप्रथानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitraḥ samrājo varuṇo yuvāna ādityāsaḥ kavayaḥ paprathānāḥ ||
Translation: Young, Sovran Rulers, Varuṇa and Mitra, the wise and very glorious Ādityas.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यपाणिः सविता सुजिह्वस्त्रिरा दिवो विदथे पत्यमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyapāṇiḥ savitā sujihvastrirā divo vidathe patyamānaḥ |
Translation: 11 The fair-tongued Savitar, the golden-handed, comes thrice from heaven as Lord in our assembly.

Sanskit Text: देवेषु च सवितः शलोकमश्रेरादस्मभ्यमा सुवसर्वतातिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: deveṣu ca savitaḥ ślokamaśrerādasmabhyamā suvasarvatātim ||
Translation: Bear to the Gods this song of praise, and send us, then, Savitar, complete and perfect safety.

Sanskit Text: सुक्र्त सुपाणिः सववान रतावा देवस्त्वष्टावसे तानि नोधात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sukṛt supāṇiḥ svavān ṛtāvā devastvaṣṭāvase tāni nodhāt |
Translation: 12 Deft worker, skiful-handed, helpful, holy, may Tvaṣṭar, God, give us these things to aid us,

Sanskit Text: पूषण्वन्त रभवो मादयध्वमूर्ध्वग्रावाणो अध्वरमतष्ट ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūṣaṇvanta ṛbhavo mādayadhvamūrdhvaghrāvāṇo adhvaramataṣṭa ||
Translation: Take your delight, Ye Ṛbhus joined with Pūṣan: ye have prepared the rite with stones adjusted.

Sanskit Text: विद्युद्रथा मरुत रष्टिमन्तो दिवो मर्या रतजाता अयासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidyudrathā maruta ṛṣṭimanto divo maryā ṛtajātā ayāsaḥ |
Translation: 13 Borne on their flashing car, the spear-armed Maruts, the nimble Youths of Heaven, the Sons of Order,

Sanskit Text: सरस्वती शर्णवन यज्ञियासो धाता रयिं सहवीरं तुरासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarasvatī śṛṇavan yajñiyāso dhātā rayiṃ sahavīraṃ turāsaḥ ||
Translation: The Holy, and Sarasvatī, shall hear us: ye Mighty, give us wealth with noble offspring.

Sanskit Text: विष्णुं सतोमासः पुरुदस्ममर्का भगस्येव कारिणो यामनि गमन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viṣṇuṃ stomāsaḥ purudasmamarkā bhaghasyeva kāriṇo yāmani ghman |
Translation: 14 To Viṣṇu rich in marvels, songs And praises shall go as singers on the road of Bhaga,—

Sanskit Text: उरुक्रमः ककुहो यस्य पूर्विर्न मर्धन्ति युवतयोजनित्रीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: urukramaḥ kakuho yasya pūrvirna mardhanti yuvatayojanitrīḥ ||
Translation: The Chieftain of the Mighty Stride, whose Mothers, the many young Dames, never disregard him.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो विश्वैर्वीर्यैः पत्यमान उभे आ पप्रौ रोदसी महित्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro viśvairvīryaiḥ patyamāna ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā |
Translation: 15 Indra, who rules through all his powers heroic, hath with his majesty filled earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: पुरन्दरो वर्त्रहा धर्ष्णुषेणः संग्र्भ्या न आ भरा भूरि पश्वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purandaro vṛtrahā dhṛṣṇuṣeṇaḥ saṃghṛbhyā na ā bharā bhūri paśvaḥ ||
Translation: Lord of brave hosts, Fort-crusher, Vṛtra-slayer, gather thou up and bring us store of cattle.

Sanskit Text: नासत्या मे पितरा बन्धुप्र्छा सजात्यमश्विनोश्चारु नाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāsatyā me pitarā bandhupṛchā sajātyamaśvinoścāru nāma |
Translation: 16 My Sires are the Nāsatyas, kind tokinsmen: the Aśvins' kinship is a glorious title.

Sanskit Text: युवं हि सथो रयिदौ नो रयीणां दात्रं रक्षेथे अकवैरदब्धा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ hi stho rayidau no rayīṇāṃ dātraṃ rakṣethe akavairadabdhā ||
Translation: For ye are they who give us store of riches: ye guard your gift uncheated by the bounteous.

Sanskit Text: महत तद वः कवयश्चारु नाम यद ध देव भवथ विश्व इन्द्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahat tad vaḥ kavayaścāru nāma yad dha deva bhavatha viśva indre |
Translation: 17 This is, ye Wise, your great and glorious title, that all ye Deities abide in Indra.

Sanskit Text: सख रभुभिः पुरुहूत परियेभिरिमां धियं सातये तक्षता नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakha ṛbhubhiḥ puruhūta priyebhirimāṃ dhiyaṃ sātaye takṣatā naḥ ||
Translation: Friend, Much-invoked! art thou with thy dear Ṛbhus: fashion ye this our hymn for our advantage.

Sanskit Text: अर्यमा णो अदितिर्यज्ञियासो.अदब्धानि वरुणस्य वरतानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aryamā ṇo aditiryajñiyāso.adabdhāni varuṇasya vratāni |
Translation: 18 Aryaman, Aditi deserve our worship: the laws of Varuṇa remain unbroken.

Sanskit Text: युयोत नो अनपत्यानि गन्तोः परजावान नः पशुमानस्तु गातुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuyota no anapatyāni ghantoḥ prajāvān naḥ paśumānastu ghātuḥ ||
Translation: The lot of childlessness remove ye from us, and let our course be rich in kine and offspring.

Sanskit Text: देवानां दूतः पुरुध परसूतो.अनागान नो वोचतु सर्वताता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānāṃ dūtaḥ purudha prasūto.anāghān no vocatu sarvatātā |
Translation: 19 May the Gods’ envoy, sent to many a quarter, proclaim us sinless for our perfect safety.

Sanskit Text: शर्णोतु नः पर्थिवी दयौरुतापः सूर्यो नक्षत्रैरुर्वन्तरिक्षम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇotu naḥ pṛthivī dyaurutāpaḥ sūryo nakṣatrairurvantarikṣam ||
Translation: May Earth and Heaven, the Sun, the waters, hear us, and the wide firmament and constellations.

Sanskit Text: शर्ण्वन्तु नो वर्षणः पर्वतासो धरुवक्षेमास इळया मदन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇvantu no vṛṣaṇaḥ parvatāso dhruvakṣemāsa iḷayā madantaḥ |
Translation: 20 Hear us the mouatains which distil the rain-drops, and, resting firm, rejoice in freshening moisture.

Sanskit Text: आदित्यैर्नो अदितिः शर्णोतु यछन्तु नो मरुतः शर्मभद्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityairno aditiḥ śṛṇotu yachantu no marutaḥ śarmabhadram ||
Translation: May Aditi with the Ādityas hear us, and Maruts grant us their auspicious shelter.

Sanskit Text: सदा सुगः पितुमानस्तु पन्था मध्व देवा ओषधीः सम्पिप्र्क्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadā sughaḥ pitumānastu panthā madhva devā oṣadhīḥ sampipṛkta |
Translation: 21 Soft be our path for ever, well-provisioned: with pleasant meath, O Gods, the herbs besprinkle.

Sanskit Text: भगो मे अग्ने सख्ये न मर्ध्या उद रायो अश्यां सदनं पुरुक्षोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhagho me aghne sakhye na mṛdhyā ud rāyo aśyāṃ sadanaṃ purukṣoḥ ||
Translation: Safe be my bliss, O Agni, in thy friendship: may I attain the seat of foodful. riches,

Sanskit Text: सवदस्व हव्या समिषो दिदीह्यस्मद्र्यक सं मिमीहि शरवांसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svadasva havyā samiṣo didīhyasmadryak saṃ mimīhi śravāṃsi |
Translation: 22 Enjoy the offering: beam thou strength upon us; combine thou for our good all kinds of glory.

Sanskit Text: विश्वानग्ने पर्त्सु तञ जेषि शत्रूनहा विश्वा सुमना दीदिही नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvānaghne pṛtsu tañ jeṣi śatrūnahā viśvā sumanā dīdihī naḥ ||
Translation: Conquer in battle, Agni, all those foemen, and light us every day with loving kindness.

Sanskit Text: उषसः पूर्वा अध यद वयूषुर्महद वि जज्ञे अक्षरं पदे गोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣasaḥ pūrvā adha yad vyūṣurmahad vi jajñe akṣaraṃ pade ghoḥ |
Translation: 1. AT the first shining of the earliest Mornings, in the Cow's home was born the Great Eternal.

Sanskit Text: वरता देवानामुप नु परभूषन महद देवानामसुरत्वमेकम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vratā devānāmupa nu prabhūṣan mahad devānāmasuratvamekam ||
Translation: Now shall the statutes of the Gods be valid. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion -

Sanskit Text: मो षू णो अत्र जुहुरन्त देवा मा पूर्वे अग्ने पितरः पदज्ञाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mo ṣū ṇo atra juhuranta devā mā pūrve aghne pitaraḥ padajñāḥ |
Translation: 2 Let not the Gods here injure us, O Agni, nor Fathers of old time who know the region,

Sanskit Text: पुराण्योः सद्मनोः केतुरन्तर्म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purāṇyoḥ sadmanoḥ keturantarma... ||
Translation: Nor the sign set between two ancient dwellings. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: वि मे पुरुत्रा पतयन्ति कामाः शम्यछा दीद्ये पूर्व्याणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi me purutrā patayanti kāmāḥ śamyachā dīdye pūrvyāṇi |
Translation: 3 My wishes fly abroad to many places: I glance back to the ancient sacrifices.

Sanskit Text: समिद्धे अग्नाव रतमिद वदेम म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samiddhe aghnāv ṛtamid vadema ma... ||
Translation: Let us declare the truth when fire is kindled. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: समानो राजा विभ्र्तः पुरुत्रा शये शयासु परयुतो वनानु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samāno rājā vibhṛtaḥ purutrā śaye śayāsu prayuto vanānu |
Translation: 4 King Universal, born to sundry quarters, extended through the wood be lies on couches.

Sanskit Text: अन्या वत्सं भरति कषेति माता म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anyā vatsaṃ bharati kṣeti mātā ma... ||
Translation: One Mother rests: another feeds the Infant. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: आक्षित पूर्वास्वपरा अनूरुत सद्यो जातासु तरुणीष्वन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ākṣit pūrvāsvaparā anūrut sadyo jātāsu taruṇīṣvantaḥ |
Translation: 5 Lodged in old plants, he grows again in younger, swiftly within the newly-born and tender.

Sanskit Text: अन्तर्वतीः सुवते अप्रवीता म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: antarvatīḥ suvate apravītā ma... ||
Translation: Though they are unimpregned, he makes them fruitful. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: शयुः परस्तादध नु दविमाताबन्धनश्चरति वत्स एकः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śayuḥ parastādadha nu dvimātābandhanaścarati vatsa ekaḥ |
Translation: 6 Now lying far away, Child of two Mothers, he wanders unrestrained, the single youngling.

Sanskit Text: मित्रस्य ता वरुणस्य वरतानि म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitrasya tā varuṇasya vratāni ma... ||
Translation: These are the laws of Varuṇa and Mitra. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: दविमाता होता विदथेषु सम्राळ अन्वग्रं चरति कषेति बुध्नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvimātā hotā vidatheṣu samrāḷ anvaghraṃ carati kṣeti budhnaḥ |
Translation: 7 Child of two Mothers, Priest, sole Lord in synods, he still precedes while resting as foundation.

Sanskit Text: पर रण्यानि रण्यवाचो भरन्ते म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra raṇyāni raṇyavāco bharante ma... ||
Translation: They who speak sweetly bring him sweet addresses. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: शूरस्येव युध्यतो अन्तमस्य परतीचीनं दद्र्शे विश्वमायत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śūrasyeva yudhyato antamasya pratīcīnaṃ dadṛśe viśvamāyat |
Translation: 8 As to a friendly warrior when he battles, each thing that comes anear is seen to meet him.

Sanskit Text: अन्तर्मतिश्चरति निष्षिधं गोर्म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: antarmatiścarati niṣṣidhaṃ ghorma... ||
Translation: The hymn commingles with the cow's oblation. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: नि वेवेति पलितो दूत आस्वन्तर्महांश्चरति रोचनेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni veveti palito dūta āsvantarmahāṃścarati rocanena |
Translation: 9 Deep within these the hoary envoy pierceth; mighty, he goeth to the realm of splendour,

Sanskit Text: वपूंषि बिभ्रदभि नो वि चष्टे म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vapūṃṣi bibhradabhi no vi caṣṭe ma... ||
Translation: And looketh on us, clad in wondrous beauty. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: विष्णुर्गोपाः परमं पाति पाथः परिया धामान्यम्र्तादधानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viṣṇurghopāḥ paramaṃ pāti pāthaḥ priyā dhāmānyamṛtādadhānaḥ |
Translation: 10 Viṣṇu, the guardian, keeps the loftiest station, upholding dear, immortal dwelling-places.

Sanskit Text: अग्निष टा विश्वा भुवनानि वेद म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṣ ṭā viśvā bhuvanāni veda ma... ||
Translation: Agni knows well all these created beings. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: नाना चक्राते यम्या वपूंषि तयोरन्यद रोचते कर्ष्णमन्यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nānā cakrāte yamyā vapūṃṣi tayoranyad rocate kṛṣṇamanyat |
Translation: 11 Ye, variant Pair, have made yourselves twin beauties: one of the Twain is dark, bright shines the other;

Sanskit Text: शयावी च यदरुषी च सवसारौ म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śyāvī ca yadaruṣī ca svasārau ma... ||
Translation: And yet these two, the dark, the red, are Sisters. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: माता च यत्र दुहिता च धेनू सबर्दुघे धापयेते समीची |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mātā ca yatra duhitā ca dhenū sabardughe dhāpayete samīcī |
Translation: 12 Where the two Cows, the Mother and the Daughter, meet and give suck yielding their lordly nectar,

Sanskit Text: रतस्य ते सदसीळे अन्तर्म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya te sadasīḷe antarma... ||
Translation: I praise them at the seat of law eternal. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: अन्यस्या वत्सं रिहती मिमाय कया भुवा नि दधे धेनुरूधः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anyasyā vatsaṃ rihatī mimāya kayā bhuvā ni dadhe dhenurūdhaḥ |
Translation: 13 Loud hath she lowed, licking the other's youngling. On what world hath the Milch-cow laid her udder?

Sanskit Text: रतस्य सा पयसापिन्वतेळा म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya sā payasāpinvateḷā ma... ||
Translation: This Iḷā streameth with the milk of Order. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: पद्या वस्ते पुरुरूपा वपूंष्यूर्ध्वा तस्थौ तर्यविं रेरिहाणा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: padyā vaste pururūpā vapūṃṣyūrdhvā tasthau tryaviṃ rerihāṇā |
Translation: 14 Earth weareth beauties manifold: uplifted, licking her Calf of eighteen months, she standeth.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य सद्म वि चरामि विद्वान म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya sadma vi carāmi vidvān ma... ||
Translation: Well-skilled I seek the seat of law eternal. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: पदे इव निहिते दस्मे अन्तस्तयोरन्यद गुह्यमाविरन्यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pade iva nihite dasme antastayoranyad ghuhyamāviranyat |
Translation: 15 Within a wondrous place the Twain are treasured: the one is manifest, the other hidden.

Sanskit Text: सध्रीचीना पथ्या सा विषूची म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadhrīcīnā pathyā sā viṣūcī ma... ||
Translation: One common pathway leads in two directions. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: आ धेनवो धुनयन्तामशिश्वीः सबर्दुघाः शशया अप्रदुग्धाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā dhenavo dhunayantāmaśiśvīḥ sabardughāḥ śaśayā apradughdhāḥ |
Translation: 16 Let the milch-kine that have no calves storm downward, yielding rich nectar, streaming, unexhausted,

Sanskit Text: नव्या-नव्या युवतयो भवन्तीर्म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: navyā-navyā yuvatayo bhavantīrma... ||
Translation: These who are ever new and fresh and youthful. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: यदन्यासु वर्षभो रोरवीति सो अन्यस्मिन यूथे नि दधातिरेतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadanyāsu vṛṣabho roravīti so anyasmin yūthe ni dadhātiretaḥ |
Translation: 17 What time the Bull bellows in other regions, another herd receives the genial moisture;

Sanskit Text: स हि कषपावान स भगः स राजा म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi kṣapāvān sa bhaghaḥ sa rājā ma... ||
Translation: For he is Bhaga, King, the earth's Protector. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: वीरस्य नु सवश्व्यं जनासः पर नु वोचाम विदुरस्य देवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vīrasya nu svaśvyaṃ janāsaḥ pra nu vocāma vidurasya devāḥ |
Translation: 18 Let us declare the Hero's wealth in horses, O all ye folk: of this the Gods have knowledge.

Sanskit Text: षोळ्हा युक्ताः पञ्च-पञ्चा वहन्ति म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṣoḷhā yuktāḥ pañca-pañcā vahanti ma... ||
Translation: Sixfold they bear him, or by fives are harnessed. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: देवस्त्वष्टा सविता विश्वरूपः पुपोष परजाः पुरुधाजजान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devastvaṣṭā savitā viśvarūpaḥ pupoṣa prajāḥ purudhājajāna |
Translation: 19 Tvaṣṭar the God, the omniform. Creator, begets and feeds mankind in various manner.

Sanskit Text: इमा च विश्वा भुवनान्यस्य म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā ca viśvā bhuvanānyasya ma... ||
Translation: His, verily, arc all these living creatures. Great is the Gods’ supreme dominion.

Sanskit Text: मही समैरच्चम्वा समीची उभे ते अस्य वसुना नय्र्ष्टे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahī samairaccamvā samīcī ubhe te asya vasunā nyṛṣṭe |
Translation: 20 The two great meeting Bowls hath he united: each of the Pair is laden with histreasure.

Sanskit Text: शर्ण्वे वीरो विन्दमानो वसूनि म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇve vīro vindamāno vasūni ma... ||
Translation: The Hero is renowned for gathering riches. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: इमां च नः पर्थिवीं विश्वधाया उप कषेति हितमित्रो नराजा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imāṃ ca naḥ pṛthivīṃ viśvadhāyā upa kṣeti hitamitro narājā |
Translation: 21 Yea, and on this our earth the All-Sustainer dwells like a King with noble friends about him.

Sanskit Text: पुरःसदः शर्मसदो न वीरा म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: puraḥsadaḥ śarmasado na vīrā ma... ||
Translation: In his protection heroes rest in safety. Great is the Cods' supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: निष्षिध्वरीस्त ओषधीरुतापो रयिं त इन्द्र पर्थिवी बिभर्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: niṣṣidhvarīsta oṣadhīrutāpo rayiṃ ta indra pṛthivī bibharti |
Translation: 22 Rich in their gifts for thee are herbs and waters, and earth brings all her wealth for thee, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: सखायस्ते वामभाजः सयाम म... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhāyaste vāmabhājaḥ syāma ma... ||
Translation: May we as friends of thine share goodly treasures. Great is the Gods’ supreme and sole dominion.

Sanskit Text: पर मे विविक्वानविदन मनीषां धेनुं चरन्तीं परयुतामगोपाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra me vivikvānavidan manīṣāṃ dhenuṃ carantīṃ prayutāmaghopām |
Translation: 1. MY thought with fine discernment hath discovered the Cow who wanders free without a herdsman,

Sanskit Text: सद्यश्चिद या दुदुहे भूरि धासेरिन्द्रस्तदग्निः पनितारो अस्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadyaścid yā duduhe bhūri dhāserindrastadaghniḥ panitāro asyāḥ ||
Translation: Her who hath straightway poured me food in plenty: Indra and Agni therefore are her praisers.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रः सु पूषा वर्षणा सुहस्ता दिवो न परीताः शशयं दुदुह्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraḥ su pūṣā vṛṣaṇā suhastā divo na prītāḥ śaśayaṃ duduhre |
Translation: 2 Indra and Pūṣan, deft of hand and mighty, well-pleased have drained the heaven's exhaustless udder.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे यदस्यां रणयन्त देवाः पर वो.अत्र वसवः सुम्नमश्याम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve yadasyāṃ raṇayanta devāḥ pra vo.atra vasavaḥ sumnamaśyām ||
Translation: As in this praise the Gods have all delighted, may I win blessing here from you, O Vasus.

Sanskit Text: या जामयो वर्ष्ण इछन्ति शक्तिं नमस्यन्तीर्जानते गर्भमस्मिन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā jāmayo vṛṣṇa ichanti śaktiṃ namasyantīrjānate gharbhamasmin |
Translation: 3 Fain to lend vigour to the Bull, the siste.. with reverence recognize the germ within him.

Sanskit Text: अछा पुत्रं धेनवो वावशाना महश्चरन्ति बिभ्रतं वपूंषि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā putraṃ dhenavo vāvaśānā mahaścaranti bibhrataṃ vapūṃṣi ||
Translation: The Cows come lowing hither to the Youngling, to him endued with great and wondrous beauties.

Sanskit Text: अछा विवक्मि रोदसी सुमेके गराव्णो युजानो अध्वरे मनीषा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā vivakmi rodasī sumeke ghrāvṇo yujāno adhvare manīṣā |
Translation: 4 Fixing with thought, at sacrifice, the press-stones, I bid the well-formed Heaven and Earth come hither;

Sanskit Text: इमा उ ते मनवे भूरिवारा ऊर्ध्वा भवन्ति दर्शता यजत्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā u te manave bhūrivārā ūrdhvā bhavanti darśatā yajatrāḥ ||
Translation: For these thy flames, which give men boons in plenty, rise up on high, the beautiful, the holy.

Sanskit Text: या ते जिह्वा मधुमती सुमेधा अग्ने देवेषूच्यत उरूची |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā te jihvā madhumatī sumedhā aghne deveṣūcyata urūcī |
Translation: 5 Agni, thy meath-sweet tongue that tastes fair viands, which among Gods is called the far-extended,—

Sanskit Text: तयेह विश्वानवसे यजत्राना सादय पायया चा मधूनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tayeha viśvānavase yajatrānā sādaya pāyayā cā madhūni ||
Translation: Therewith make all the Holy Odes be seated here for our help, and feed them with sweet juices.

Sanskit Text: या ते अग्ने पर्वतस्येव धारासश्चन्ती पीपयद देव चित्रा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā te aghne parvatasyeva dhārāsaścantī pīpayad deva citrā |
Translation: 6 Let thy stream give us drink, O God, O Agni, wonderful and exhaustless like the rain-clouds.

Sanskit Text: तामस्मभ्यं परमतिं जातवेदो वसो रास्व सुमतिं विश्वजन्याम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāmasmabhyaṃ pramatiṃ jātavedo vaso rāsva sumatiṃ viśvajanyām ||
Translation: Thus care for us, O Vasu Jātavedas, show us thy loving-kindness, reaching all men.

Sanskit Text: धेनुः परत्नस्य काम्यं दुहानान्तः पुत्रश्चरति दक्षिणायाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhenuḥ pratnasya kāmyaṃ duhānāntaḥ putraścarati dakṣiṇāyāḥ |
Translation: 1. THE Ancient's Milch-cow yields the things we long for: the Son of Dakṣiṇā travels between them.

Sanskit Text: आ दयोतनिं वहति शुभ्रयामोषस सतोमो अश्विनावजीगः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā dyotaniṃ vahati śubhrayāmoṣasa stomo aśvināvajīghaḥ ||
Translation: She with the splendid chariot brings refulgence. The praise of Uṣas hath awoke the Aśvins.

Sanskit Text: सुयुग वहन्ति परति वां रतेनोर्ध्वा भवन्ति पितरेव मेधाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suyugh vahanti prati vāṃ ṛtenordhvā bhavanti pitareva medhāḥ |
Translation: 2 They bear you hither by well-orderd statute: our sacred offerings rise as if to parents.

Sanskit Text: जरेथामस्मद वि पणेर्महीषां युवोरवश्चक्र्मा यातमर्वाक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jarethāmasmad vi paṇermahīṣāṃ yuvoravaścakṛmā yātamarvāk ||
Translation: Destroy in us the counsel of the niggard come hitherward, for we have shown you favour.

Sanskit Text: सुयुग्भिरश्वैः सुव्र्ता रथेन दस्राविमं शर्णुतं शलोकमद्रेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suyughbhiraśvaiḥ suvṛtā rathena dasrāvimaṃ śṛṇutaṃ ślokamadreḥ |
Translation: 3 With lightly-rolling car and well-yoked horses hear this, the press-stone's song, ye Wonder-Workers.

Sanskit Text: किमङग वां परत्यवर्तिं गमिष्ठाहुर्विप्रासो अश्विना पुराजाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kimaṅgha vāṃ pratyavartiṃ ghamiṣṭhāhurviprāso aśvinā purājāḥ ||
Translation: Have not the sages of old time, ye Aśvins, called you most prompt to come and stay misfortune?

Sanskit Text: आ मन्येथामा गतं कच्चिदेवैर्विश्वे जनासो अश्विना हवन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā manyethāmā ghataṃ kaccidevairviśve janāso aśvinā havante |
Translation: 4 Remember us, and come to us, for ever men, as their wont is, invocate the Aśvins.

Sanskit Text: इमा हि वां गोर्जीका मधूनि पर मित्रासो न ददुरुस्रो अग्रे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā hi vāṃ ghoṛjīkā madhūni pra mitrāso na dadurusro aghre ||
Translation: Friends as it were have offered you these juices, sweet, blent with milk at the first break of morning.

Sanskit Text: तिरः पुरू चिदश्विना रजांस्याङगूषो वां मघवाना जनेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tiraḥ purū cidaśvinā rajāṃsyāṅghūṣo vāṃ maghavānā janeṣu |
Translation: 5 Even through many regions, O ye Aśvins high praise is yours among mankind, ye Mighty-

Sanskit Text: एह यातं पथिभिर्देवयानैर्दस्राविमे वां निधयो मधूनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eha yātaṃ pathibhirdevayānairdasrāvime vāṃ nidhayo madhūnām ||
Translation: Come, helpers, on the paths which Gods have travelled: here your libations of sweet meath are ready.

Sanskit Text: पुराणमोकः सख्यं शिवं वां युवोर्नरा दरविणं जह्नाव्याम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purāṇamokaḥ sakhyaṃ śivaṃ vāṃ yuvornarā draviṇaṃ jahnāvyām |
Translation: 6 Ancient your home, auspicious is your friendship: Heroes, your wealth is with the house of Jahnu.

Sanskit Text: पुनः कर्ण्वानाः सख्या शिवानि मध्वा मदेमसह नू समानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punaḥ kṛṇvānāḥ sakhyā śivāni madhvā mademasaha nū samānāḥ ||
Translation: Forming again with you auspicious friendship, let us rejoice with draughts of meath together.

Sanskit Text: अश्विना वायुना युवं सुदक्षा नियुद्भिष च सजोषसा युवाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvinā vāyunā yuvaṃ sudakṣā niyudbhiṣ ca sajoṣasā yuvānā |
Translation: 7 O Aśvins, Very Mighty ones, with Vāyu and with his steeds, one-minded, ever-youthful,

Sanskit Text: नासत्या तिरोह्न्यं जुषाणा सोमं पिबतमस्रिधा सुदानू ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāsatyā tiroahnyaṃ juṣāṇā somaṃ pibatamasridhā sudānū ||
Translation: Nāsatyas, joying in the third day's Soma, drink it, not hostile, Very Bounteous Givers.

Sanskit Text: अश्विना परि वामिषः पुरूचीरीयुर्गीर्भिर्यतमाना अम्र्ध्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvinā pari vāmiṣaḥ purūcīrīyurghīrbhiryatamānā amṛdhrāḥ |
Translation: 8 Aśvins, to you are brought abundant viands in rivalry with sacred songs, unceasing.

Sanskit Text: रथो ह वां रतजा अद्रिजूतः परि दयावाप्र्थिवी याति सद्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ratho ha vāṃ ṛtajā adrijūtaḥ pari dyāvāpṛthivī yāti sadyaḥ ||
Translation: Sprung from high Law your car, urged on by press-stones, goes round the earth and heaven in one brief moment.

Sanskit Text: अश्विना मधुषुत्तमो युवाकुः सोमस्तं पातमा गतं दुरोणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvinā madhuṣuttamo yuvākuḥ somastaṃ pātamā ghataṃ duroṇe |
Translation: 9 Aśvins, your Soma sheds delicious sweetness: drink ye thereof and come unto our dwelling.

Sanskit Text: रथो ह वां भूरि वर्पः करिक्रत सुतावतो निष्क्र्तमागमिष्ठः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ratho ha vāṃ bhūri varpaḥ karikrat sutāvato niṣkṛtamāghamiṣṭhaḥ ||
Translation: Your car, assuming many a shape, most often goes to the Soma-presser's place of meeting.

Sanskit Text: मित्रो जनान यातयति बरुवाणो मित्रो दाधार पर्थिवीमुत दयाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitro janān yātayati bruvāṇo mitro dādhāra pṛthivīmuta dyām |
Translation: 1. MITRA, when speaking, stirreth men to labour: Mitra sustaineth both the earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: मित्रः कर्ष्टीरनिमिषाभि चष्टे मित्राय हव्यंघ्र्तवज्जुहोत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitraḥ kṛṣṭīranimiṣābhi caṣṭe mitrāya havyaṃghṛtavajjuhota ||
Translation: Mitra beholdeth men with eyes that close not. To Mitra bring, with holy oil, oblation.

Sanskit Text: पर स मित्र मर्तो अस्तु परयस्वान यस्त आदित्य शिक्षति वरतेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sa mitra marto astu prayasvān yasta āditya śikṣati vratena |
Translation: 2 Foremost be he who brings thee food, O Mitra, who strives to keep thy sacred Law, Āditya.

Sanskit Text: न हन्यते न जीयते तवोतो नैनमंहो अश्नोत्यन्तितो न दूरात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na hanyate na jīyate tvoto nainamaṃho aśnotyantito na dūrāt ||
Translation: He whom thou helpest ne’er is slain or conquered, on him, from near or far, falls no affliction.

Sanskit Text: अनमीवास इळया मदन्तो मितज्ञवो वरिमन्ना पर्थिव्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anamīvāsa iḷayā madanto mitajñavo varimannā pṛthivyāḥ |
Translation: 3 joying in sacred food and free from sickness, with knees bent lowly on the earth's broad surface,

Sanskit Text: आदित्यस्य वरतमुपक्षियन्तो वयं मित्रस्य सुमतौ सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityasya vratamupakṣiyanto vayaṃ mitrasya sumatau syāma ||
Translation: Following closely the Āditya's statute, may we remain in Mitra's gracious favour.

Sanskit Text: अयं मित्रो नमस्यः सुशेवो राजा सुक्षत्रो अजनिष्ट वेधाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ mitro namasyaḥ suśevo rājā sukṣatro ajaniṣṭa vedhāḥ |
Translation: 4 Auspicious and adorable, this Mitra was born with fair dominion, King, Disposer.

Sanskit Text: तस्य वयं ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya vayaṃ ... ||
Translation: May we enjoy the grace of him the Holy, yea, rest in his propitious loving-kindness.

Sanskit Text: महानादित्यो नमसोपसद्यो यातयज्जनो गर्णते सुशेवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahānādityo namasopasadyo yātayajjano ghṛṇate suśevaḥ |
Translation: 5 The great Āditya, to be served with wor. ship, who stirreth men, is gracious to the singer.

Sanskit Text: तस्मा एतत पन्यतमाय जुष्टमग्नौ मित्राय हविरा जुहोत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmā etat panyatamāya juṣṭamaghnau mitrāya havirā juhota ||
Translation: To Mitra, him most highly to be lauded, offer in fire oblation that he loveth.

Sanskit Text: मित्रस्य चर्षणीध्र्तो.अवो देवस्य सानसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitrasya carṣaṇīdhṛto.avo devasya sānasi |
Translation: 6 The gainful grace of Mitra,. God, supporter of the race of man,

Sanskit Text: दयुम्नं चित्रश्रवस्तमम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyumnaṃ citraśravastamam ||
Translation: Gives splendour of most.glorious fame.

Sanskit Text: अभि यो महिना दिवं मित्रो बभूव सप्रथाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi yo mahinā divaṃ mitro babhūva saprathāḥ |
Translation: 7 Mitra whose glory spreads afar, he who in might surpasses heaven,

Sanskit Text: अभि शरवोभिः पर्थिवीम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi śravobhiḥ pṛthivīm ||
Translation: Surpasses earth in his renown.

Sanskit Text: मित्राय पञ्च येमिरे जना अभिष्टिशवसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitrāya pañca yemire janā abhiṣṭiśavase |
Translation: 8 All the Five Races have repaired to Mitra, ever strong to aid,

Sanskit Text: स देवान विश्वान बिभर्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa devān viśvān bibharti ||
Translation: For he sustaineth all the Gods.

Sanskit Text: मित्रो देवेष्वायुषु जनाय वर्क्तबर्हिषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitro deveṣvāyuṣu janāya vṛktabarhiṣe |
Translation: 9 Mitra to Gods, to living men, to him who strews the holy grass,

Sanskit Text: इष इष्टव्रताकः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣa iṣṭavratāakaḥ ||
Translation: Gives food fulfilling sacred Law.

Sanskit Text: इहेह वो मनसा बन्धुता नर उशिजो जग्मुरभि तानि वेदसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iheha vo manasā bandhutā nara uśijo jaghmurabhi tāni vedasā |
Translation: 1. HERE is your ghostly kinship, here, O Men: they came desirous to these holy rites with store of wealth,

Sanskit Text: याभिर्मायाभिः परतिजूतिवर्पसः सौधन्वना यज्ञियं भागमानश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirmāyābhiḥ pratijūtivarpasaḥ saudhanvanā yajñiyaṃ bhāghamānaśa ||
Translation: With wondrous arts, whereby, with schemes to meet each need, Ye gained, Sudhanvan's Sons! your share in sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: याभिः शचीभिश्चमसानपिंशत यया धिया गामरिणीत चर्मणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ śacībhiścamasānapiṃśata yayā dhiyā ghāmariṇīta carmaṇaḥ |
Translation: 2 The mighty powers wherewith. ye formed the chalices, the thought by which ye drew the cow from out the hide,

Sanskit Text: येन हरी मनसा निरतक्षत तेन देवत्वं रभवः समानश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena harī manasā niratakṣata tena devatvaṃ ṛbhavaḥ samānaśa ||
Translation: The intellect wherewith ye wrought the two Bay Steeds,—through these, O Ṛbhus, ye attained divinity.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य सख्यं रभवः समानशुर्मनोर्नपातो अपसो दधन्विरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya sakhyaṃ ṛbhavaḥ samānaśurmanornapāto apaso dadhanvire |
Translation: 3 Friendship with Indra have the Ṛbhus, fully gained: grandsons of Manu, they skilfully urged the work.

Sanskit Text: सौधन्वनासो अम्र्तत्वमेरिरे विष्ट्वी शमीभिः सुक्र्तः सुक्र्त्यया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saudhanvanāso amṛtatvamerire viṣṭvī śamībhiḥ sukṛtaḥ sukṛtyayā ||
Translation: Sudhanvan's Children won them everlasting life, serving with holy rites, pious with noble acts.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रेण याथ सरथं सुते सचानथो वशानां भवथासह शरिया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indreṇa yātha sarathaṃ sute sacānatho vaśānāṃ bhavathāsaha śriyā |
Translation: 4:In company with Indra come ye to the juice, then gloriously shall your wishes be fulfilled.

Sanskit Text: न वः परतिमै सुक्र्तानि वाघतः सौधन्वना रभवो वीर्याणि च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na vaḥ pratimai sukṛtāni vāghataḥ saudhanvanā ṛbhavo vīryāṇi ca ||
Translation: Not to be paragoned, ye Priests, are your good deeds, nor your heroic acts, Ṛbhus, Sudhanvan's Sons.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र रभुभिर्वाजवद्भिः समुक्षितं सुतं सोममा वर्षस्वा गभस्त्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra ṛbhubhirvājavadbhiḥ samukṣitaṃ sutaṃ somamā vṛṣasvā ghabhastyoḥ |
Translation: 5 O Indra, with the Ṛbhus, Mighty Ones, pour down the Soma juice effused, well-blent, from both thy hands.

Sanskit Text: धियेषितो मघवन दाशुषो गर्हे सौधन्वनेभिः सह मत्स्वा नर्भिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiyeṣito maghavan dāśuṣo ghṛhe saudhanvanebhiḥ saha matsvā nṛbhiḥ ||
Translation: Maghalan, urged by song, in the drink-offerer's house rejoice thee with the Heroes, with Sudhanvan's Sons.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र रभुमान वाजवान मत्स्वेह नो.अस्मिन सवने शच्या पुरुष्टुत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra ṛbhumān vājavān matsveha no.asmin savane śacyā puruṣṭuta |
Translation: 6 With Ṛbhu near, and Vāja, Indra, here exult, with Saci, praised of many, in the juice we pour.

Sanskit Text: इमानि तुभ्यं सवसराणि येमिरे वरता देवानां मनुषश्च धर्मभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imāni tubhyaṃ svasarāṇi yemire vratā devānāṃ manuṣaśca dharmabhiḥ ||
Translation: These homes wherein we dwell have turned themselves to thee, -devotions to the Gods, as laws of men ordain.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र रभुभिर्वाजिभिर्वाजयन्निह सतोमं जरितुरुप याहि यज्ञियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra ṛbhubhirvājibhirvājayanniha stomaṃ jariturupa yāhi yajñiyam |
Translation: 7 Come with the mighty Ṛbhus, Indra, come to us, strengthening with thy help the singer's holy praise;

Sanskit Text: शतं केतेभिरिषिरेभिरायवे सहस्रणीथोध्वरस्य होमनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ ketebhiriṣirebhirāyave sahasraṇīthoadhvarasya homani ||
Translation: At hundred eager calls come to the living man, with thousand arts attend the act of sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: उषो वाजेन वाजिनि परचेता सतोमं जुषस्व गर्णतो मघोनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣo vājena vājini pracetā stomaṃ juṣasva ghṛṇato maghoni |
Translation: 1. O Uṣas, strong with strength, endowed witli knowledge, accept the singer's praise, O wealthy Lady.

Sanskit Text: पुराणी देवि युवतिः पुरन्धिरनु वरतं चरसि विश्ववारे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purāṇī devi yuvatiḥ purandhiranu vrataṃ carasi viśvavāre ||
Translation: Thou, Goddess, ancient, young, and full of wisdom, movest, all-bounteous! as the Law ordaineth.

Sanskit Text: उषो देव्यमर्त्या वि भाहि चन्द्ररथा सून्र्ता ईरयन्ती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣo devyamartyā vi bhāhi candrarathā sūnṛtā īrayantī |
Translation: 2 Shine forth, O Morning, thou auspicious Goddess, on thy bright car awaking pleasant voices.

Sanskit Text: आ तवा वहन्तु सुयमासो अश्वा हिरण्यवर्णां पर्थुपाजसो ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tvā vahantu suyamāso aśvā hiraṇyavarṇāṃ pṛthupājaso ye ||
Translation: Let docile horses of far-reaching splendour convey thee hitherward, the goldencoloured.

Sanskit Text: उषः परतीची भुवनानि विश्वोर्ध्वा तिष्ठस्यम्र्तस्य केतुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣaḥ pratīcī bhuvanāni viśvordhvā tiṣṭhasyamṛtasya ketuḥ |
Translation: 3 Thou, Morning, turning thee to every creature, standest on high as ensign of the Immortal,

Sanskit Text: समानमर्थं चरणीयमाना चक्रमिव नव्यस्या वव्र्त्स्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samānamarthaṃ caraṇīyamānā cakramiva navyasyā vavṛtsva ||
Translation: To one same goal ever and ever wending now, like a wheel, O newly-born, roll hi ther.

Sanskit Text: अव सयूमेव चिन्वती मघोन्युषा याति सवसरस्य पत्नी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava syūmeva cinvatī maghonyuṣā yāti svasarasya patnī |
Translation: 4 Letting her reins drop downward, Morning cometh, the wealthy Dame, the Lady of the dwelling;

Sanskit Text: सवर्जनन्ती सुभगा सुदंसा आन्ताद दिवः पप्रथ आ पर्थिव्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svarjanantī subhaghā sudaṃsā āntād divaḥ papratha ā pṛthivyāḥ ||
Translation: Bringing forth light, the Wonderful, the Blessed hath spread her from the bounds of earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: अछा वो देवीमुषसं विभातीं पर वो भरध्वं नमसा सुव्र्क्तिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā vo devīmuṣasaṃ vibhātīṃ pra vo bharadhvaṃ namasā suvṛktim |
Translation: 5 Hither invoke the radiant Goddess Morning, and bring with reverence your hymn to praise her.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वं मधुधा दिवि पाजो अश्रेत पर रोचना रुरुचे रण्वसन्द्र्क ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvaṃ madhudhā divi pājo aśret pra rocanā ruruce raṇvasandṛk ||
Translation: She, dropping sweets, hath set in heaven her brightness, and, fair to look on, hath beamed forth her splendour.

Sanskit Text: रतावरी दिवो अर्कैरबोध्या रेवती रोदसी चित्रमस्थात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtāvarī divo arkairabodhyā revatī rodasī citramasthāt |
Translation: 6 From heaven, with hymns, the Holy One was wakened: brightly to both worlds came the wealthy Lady.

Sanskit Text: आयतीमग्न उषसं विभातीं वाममेषि दरविणं भिक्षमाणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āyatīmaghna uṣasaṃ vibhātīṃ vāmameṣi draviṇaṃ bhikṣamāṇaḥ ||
Translation: To Morning, Agni, when she comes refulgent, thou goest forth soliciting fair riches.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य बुध्न उषसामिषण्यन वर्षा मही रोदसी आ विवेश |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya budhna uṣasāmiṣaṇyan vṛṣā mahī rodasī ā viveśa |
Translation: 7 On Law's firm base the speeder of the Mornings, the Bull, hath entered mighty earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: मही मित्रस्य वरुणस्य माया चन्द्रेव भानुं वि दधे पुरुत्रा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahī mitrasya varuṇasya māyā candreva bhānuṃ vi dadhe purutrā ||
Translation: Great is the power of Varuṇa and Mitra, which, bright, hath spread in every place its splendour.

Sanskit Text: यो मर्त्येष्व अम्र्त रतावा देवो देवेष्व अरतिर निधायि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo martyeṣv amṛta ṛtāvā devo deveṣv aratir nidhāyi |
Translation: 1. THE, Faithful One, Immortal among mortals, a God among the Gods, appointed envoy,

Sanskit Text: होता यजिष्ठो मह्ना शुचध्यै हव्यैर अग्निर मनुष ईरयध्यै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotā yajiṣṭho mahnā śucadhyai havyair aghnir manuṣa īrayadhyai ||
Translation: Priest, best at worship, must shine forth in glory . Agni shall be raised high with man's oblations.

Sanskit Text: इह तवं सूनो सहसो नो अद्य जातो जातां उभयां अन्तर अग्ने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iha tvaṃ sūno sahaso no adya jāto jātāṃ ubhayāṃ antar aghne |
Translation: 2 Born for us here this day, O Son of Vigour, between both races of born beings, Agni,

Sanskit Text: दूत ईयसे युयुजान रष्व रजुमुष्कान वर्षणः शुक्रांश च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūta īyase yuyujāna ṛṣva ṛjumuṣkān vṛṣaṇaḥ śukrāṃś ca ||
Translation: Thou farest as an envoy, having harnessed, Sublime One! thy strong-muscled radiant stallions.

Sanskit Text: अत्या वर्धस्नू रोहिता घर्तस्नू रतस्य मन्ये मनसा जविष्ठा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atyā vṛdhasnū rohitā ghṛtasnū ṛtasya manye manasā javiṣṭhā |
Translation: 3 I laud the ruddy steeds who pour down blessing, dropping oil, flectest through the thoualit of Order.

Sanskit Text: अन्तर ईयसे अरुषा युजानो युष्मांश च देवान विश आ च मर्तान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: antar īyase aruṣā yujāno yuṣmāṃś ca devān viśa ā ca martān ||
Translation: Yoking red horses to and fro thou goest between you Deities and mortal races.

Sanskit Text: अर्यमणं वरुणम मित्रम एषाम इन्द्राविष्णू मरुतो अश्विनोत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aryamaṇaṃ varuṇam mitram eṣām indrāviṣṇū maruto aśvinota |
Translation: 4 Aryaman, Mitra, Varuṇa, and Indra with Viṣṇu, of the Gods, Maruts and Aśvins-

Sanskit Text: सवश्वो अग्ने सुरथः सुराधा एद उ वह सुहविषे जनाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svaśvo aghne surathaḥ surādhā ed u vaha suhaviṣe janāya ||
Translation: These, Agni, with good car and steeds, bring hither, most bountiful, to folk with fair oblations.

Sanskit Text: गोमां अग्ने ऽविमां अश्वी यज्ञो नर्वत्सखा सदम इद अप्रम्र्ष्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghomāṃ aghne 'vimāṃ aśvī yajño nṛvatsakhā sadam id apramṛṣyaḥ |
Translation: 5 Agni, be this our sacrifice eternal, with brave friends, rich in kine and sheep and horses,

Sanskit Text: इळावां एषो असुर परजावान दीर्घो रयिः पर्थुबुध्नः सभावान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iḷāvāṃ eṣo asura prajāvān dīrgho rayiḥ pṛthubudhnaḥ sabhāvān ||
Translation: Rich, Asura! in sacred food and children, in full assembly, wealth broad-based and during.

Sanskit Text: यस त इध्मं जभरत सिष्विदानो मूर्धानं वा ततपते तवाया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yas ta idhmaṃ jabharat siṣvidāno mūrdhānaṃ vā tatapate tvāyā |
Translation: 6 The man who, sweating, brings for thee the fuel, and makes his head to ache, thy faithful servant,—

Sanskit Text: भुवस तस्य सवतवांः पायुर अग्ने विश्वस्मात सीम अघायत उरुष्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhuvas tasya svatavāṃḥ pāyur aghne viśvasmāt sīm aghāyata uruṣya ||
Translation: Agni, to him be a self-strong Protector guard him from all who seek to do him mischief.

Sanskit Text: यस ते भराद अन्नियते चिद अन्नं निशिषन मन्द्रम अतिथिम उदीरत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yas te bharād anniyate cid annaṃ niśiṣan mandram atithim udīrat |
Translation: 7 Who brings thee food, though thou hast food in plenty, welcomes his cheerful guest and speeds him onward,

Sanskit Text: आ देवयुर इनधते दुरोणे तस्मिन रयिर धरुवो अस्तु दास्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā devayur inadhate duroṇe tasmin rayir dhruvo astu dāsvān ||
Translation: Who kindles thee devoutly in his dwelling,to him be wealth secure and freely giving.

Sanskit Text: यस तवा दोषा य उषसि परशंसात परियं वा तवा कर्णवते हविष्मान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yas tvā doṣā ya uṣasi praśaṃsāt priyaṃ vā tvā kṛṇavate haviṣmān |
Translation: 8 Whoso sings praise to thee at eve or morning, and, with oblation, doth the thing thou lovest,—

Sanskit Text: अश्वो न सवे दम आ हेम्यावान तम अंहसः पीपरो दाश्वांसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvo na sve dama ā hemyāvān tam aṃhasaḥ pīparo dāśvāṃsam ||
Translation: In his own home, even as a goId-girt courser, rescue him from distress, the bounteous giver.

Sanskit Text: यस तुभ्यम अग्ने अम्र्ताय दाशद दुवस तवे कर्णवते यतस्रुक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yas tubhyam aghne amṛtāya dāśad duvas tve kṛṇavate yatasruk |
Translation: 9 Whoso brings gifts to thee Immortal, Agni, and doth thee service with uplifted ladle,—

Sanskit Text: न स राया शशमानो वि योषन नैनम अंहः परि वरद अघायोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na sa rāyā śaśamāno vi yoṣan nainam aṃhaḥ pari varad aghāyoḥ ||
Translation: Let him not, sorely toiling, lose his riches; let not the sinner's wickedness enclose him.

Sanskit Text: यस्य तवम अग्ने अध्वरं जुजोषो देवो मर्तस्य सुधितं रराणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya tvam aghne adhvaraṃ jujoṣo devo martasya sudhitaṃ rarāṇaḥ |
Translation: 10 Whose well-wrought worship thou acceptest, Agni, thou God a mortal's gift, thou liberal Giver,—

Sanskit Text: परीतेद असद धोत्रा सा यविष्ठासाम यस्य विधतो वर्धासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prīted asad dhotrā sā yaviṣṭhāsāma yasya vidhato vṛdhāsaḥ ||
Translation: Dear be his sacrifice to thee, Most Youthful! and may we strengthen him when he adores thee.

Sanskit Text: चित्तिम अचित्तिं चिनवद वि विद्वान पर्ष्ठेव वीता वर्जिना च मर्तान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: cittim acittiṃ cinavad vi vidvān pṛṣṭheva vītā vṛjinā ca martān |
Translation: 11 May he who knows distinguish sense and folly of men, like straight and crooked backs of horses.

Sanskit Text: राये च नः सवपत्याय देव दितिं च रास्वादितिम उरुष्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāye ca naḥ svapatyāya deva ditiṃ ca rāsvāditim uruṣya ||
Translation: Lead us, O God, to wealth and noble offspring: keep penury afar and grant us plenty.

Sanskit Text: कविं शशासुः कवयो ऽदब्धा निधारयन्तो दुर्यास्व आयोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaviṃ śaśāsuḥ kavayo 'dabdhā nidhārayanto duryāsv āyoḥ |
Translation: 12 This Sage the Sages, ne’er deceived, commanded, setting him down in dwellings of the living.

Sanskit Text: अतस तवं दर्श्यां अग्न एतान पड्भिः पश्येर अद्भुतां अर्य एवैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atas tvaṃ dṛśyāṃ aghna etān paḍbhiḥ paśyer adbhutāṃ arya evaiḥ ||
Translation: Hence mayst thou, friendly God, with rapid footsteps behold the Gods, wonderful, fair to look on.

Sanskit Text: तवम अग्ने वाघते सुप्रणीतिः सुतसोमाय विधते यविष्ठ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvam aghne vāghate supraṇītiḥ sutasomāya vidhate yaviṣṭha |
Translation: 13 Good guidance hast thou for the priest, O Agni, who, Youngest God! with outpoured Soma serves thee.

Sanskit Text: रत्नम भर शशमानाय घर्ष्वे पर्थु शचन्द्रम अवसे चर्षणिप्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ratnam bhara śaśamānāya ghṛṣve pṛthu ścandram avase carṣaṇiprāḥ ||
Translation: Ruler of men, thou joyous God, bring treasure splendid and plentiful to aid the toiler.

Sanskit Text: अधा ह यद वयम अग्ने तवाया पड्भिर हस्तेभिश चक्र्मा तनूभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā ha yad vayam aghne tvāyā paḍbhir hastebhiś cakṛmā tanūbhiḥ |
Translation: 14 Now all that we, thy faithful servants, Agni, have done with feet, with hands, and with our bodies,

Sanskit Text: रथं न करन्तो अपसा भुरिजोर रतं येमुः सुध्य आशुषाणाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathaṃ na kranto apasā bhurijor ṛtaṃ yemuḥ sudhya āśuṣāṇāḥ ||
Translation: The wise, with toil, the holy rite have guided, as those who frame a car with manual cunning.

Sanskit Text: अधा मातुर उषसः सप्त विप्रा जायेमहि परथमा वेधसो नॄन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā mātur uṣasaḥ sapta viprā jāyemahi prathamā vedhaso nṝn |
Translation: 15 May we, seven sages first in rank, engender, from Dawn the Mother, men to be ordainers.

Sanskit Text: दिवस पुत्रा अङगिरसो भवेमाद्रिं रुजेम धनिनं शुचन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divas putrā aṅghiraso bhavemādriṃ rujema dhaninaṃ śucantaḥ ||
Translation: May we, Aṅgirases, be sons of Heaven, and, radiant, burst the wealth-containing mountain.

Sanskit Text: अधा यथा नः पितरः परासः परत्नासो अग्न रतम आशुषाणाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā yathā naḥ pitaraḥ parāsaḥ pratnāso aghna ṛtam āśuṣāṇāḥ |
Translation: 16 As in the days of old our ancient Fathers, speeding the work of holy worship, Agni,

Sanskit Text: शुचीद अयन दीधितिम उक्थशासः कषामा भिन्दन्तो अरुणीर अप वरन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śucīd ayan dīdhitim ukthaśāsaḥ kṣāmā bhindanto aruṇīr apa vran ||
Translation: Sought pure light and devotion, singing praises; they cleft the ground and made red Dawns apparent.

Sanskit Text: सुकर्माणः सुरुचो देवयन्तो ऽयो न देवा जनिमा धमन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sukarmāṇaḥ suruco devayanto 'yo na devā janimā dhamantaḥ |
Translation: 17 Gods, doing holy acts, devout, resplendent, smelting like ore their human generations.

Sanskit Text: शुचन्तो अग्निं वव्र्धन्त इन्द्रम ऊर्वं गव्यम परिषदन्तो अग्मन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śucanto aghniṃ vavṛdhanta indram ūrvaṃ ghavyam pariṣadanto aghman ||
Translation: Enkindling Agni and exalting Indra, they came encompassing the stall of cattle.

Sanskit Text: आ यूथेव कषुमति पश्वो अख्यद देवानां यज जनिमान्त्य उग्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yūtheva kṣumati paśvo akhyad devānāṃ yaj janimānty ughra |
Translation: 18 Strong One! he marked them-and the Gods before them-like herds of cattle in a foodful pasture.

Sanskit Text: मर्तानां चिद उर्वशीर अक्र्प्रन वर्धे चिद अर्य उपरस्यायोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: martānāṃ cid urvaśīr akṛpran vṛdhe cid arya uparasyāyoḥ ||
Translation: There they moaned forth their strong desire for mortals, to aid the True, the nearest One, the Living.

Sanskit Text: अकर्म ते सवपसो अभूम रतम अवस्रन्न उषसो विभातीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: akarma te svapaso abhūma ṛtam avasrann uṣaso vibhātīḥ |
Translation: 19 We have worked for thee, we have laboured nobly-bright Dawns have shed their light upon our worship-

Sanskit Text: अनूनम अग्निम पुरुधा सुश्चन्द्रं देवस्य मर्म्र्जतश चारु चक्षुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anūnam aghnim purudhā suścandraṃ devasya marmṛjataś cāru cakṣuḥ ||
Translation: Adding a beauty to the perfect Agni, and the God's beauteous eye that shines for ever.

Sanskit Text: एता ते अग्न उचथानि वेधो ऽवोचाम कवये ता जुषस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etā te aghna ucathāni vedho 'vocāma kavaye tā juṣasva |
Translation: 20 Agni, Disposer, we have sung these praises to thee the Wise: do thou accept them gladly.

Sanskit Text: उच छोचस्व कर्णुहि वस्यसो नो महो रायः पुरुवार पर यन्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uc chocasva kṛṇuhi vasyaso no maho rāyaḥ puruvāra pra yandhi ||
Translation: Blaze up on high and ever make us richer. Give us great wealth, O thou whose boons are many.

Sanskit Text: कर्णुष्व पाजः परसितिं न पर्थ्वीं याहि राजेवामवां इभेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṇuṣva pājaḥ prasitiṃ na pṛthvīṃ yāhi rājevāmavāṃ ibhena |
Translation: 1. PUT forth like a wide-spreading net thy vigour; go like a mighty King with his attendants.

Sanskit Text: तर्ष्वीम अनु परसितिं दरूणानो ऽसतासि विध्य रक्षसस तपिष्ठैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tṛṣvīm anu prasitiṃ drūṇāno 'stāsi vidhya rakṣasas tapiṣṭhaiḥ ||
Translation: Thou, following thy swift net, shootest arrows: transfix the fiends with darts that burn most fiercely.

Sanskit Text: तव भरमास आशुया पतन्त्य अनु सप्र्श धर्षता शोशुचानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava bhramāsa āśuyā patanty anu spṛśa dhṛṣatā śośucānaḥ |
Translation: 2 Forth go in rapid flight thy whirling weapons: follow them closely, glowing in thy fury.

Sanskit Text: तपूंष्य अग्ने जुह्वा पतंगान असंदितो वि सर्ज विष्वग उल्काः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tapūṃṣy aghne juhvā pataṃghān asaṃdito vi sṛja viṣvagh ulkāḥ ||
Translation: Spread with thy tongue the winged flames, O Agni; unfettered, cast thy firebrands all around thee.

Sanskit Text: परति सपशो वि सर्ज तूर्णितमो भवा पायुर विशो अस्या अदब्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati spaśo vi sṛja tūrṇitamo bhavā pāyur viśo asyā adabdhaḥ |
Translation: 3 Send thy spies forward, fleetest in thy motion; be, ne’er deceived, the guardian of this people

Sanskit Text: यो नो दूरे अघशंसो यो अन्त्य अग्ने माकिष टे वयथिर आ दधर्षीत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo no dūre aghaśaṃso yo anty aghne mākiṣ ṭe vyathir ā dadharṣīt ||
Translation: From him who, near or far, is bent on evil, and let no trouble sent from thee o’ercome us.

Sanskit Text: उद अग्ने तिष्ठ परत्य आ तनुष्व नय अमित्रां ओषतात तिग्महेते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud aghne tiṣṭha praty ā tanuṣva ny amitrāṃ oṣatāt tighmahete |
Translation: 4 Rise up, O Agni, spread thee out before us: burn down our foes, thou who hast sharpened arrows.

Sanskit Text: यो नो अरातिं समिधान चक्रे नीचा तं धक्ष्य अतसं न शुष्कम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo no arātiṃ samidhāna cakre nīcā taṃ dhakṣy atasaṃ na śuṣkam ||
Translation: Him, blazing Agni! who hath worked us mischief, consume thou utterly like dried-up stubble.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वो भव परति विध्याध्य अस्मद आविष कर्णुष्व दैव्यान्य अग्ने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvo bhava prati vidhyādhy asmad āviṣ kṛṇuṣva daivyāny aghne |
Translation: 5 Rise, Agni, drive off those who fight against us: make manifest thine own celestial vigour.

Sanskit Text: अव सथिरा तनुहि यातुजूनां जामिम अजामिम पर मर्णीहि शत्रून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava sthirā tanuhi yātujūnāṃ jāmim ajāmim pra mṛṇīhi śatrūn ||
Translation: Slacken the strong bows of the demon-driven: destroy our foemen whether kin or stranger.

Sanskit Text: स ते जानाति सुमतिं यविष्ठ य ईवते बरह्मणे गातुम ऐरत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa te jānāti sumatiṃ yaviṣṭha ya īvate brahmaṇe ghātum airat |
Translation: 6 Most Youthful God, he knoweth well thy favour who gave an impulse to this high devotion.

Sanskit Text: विश्वान्य अस्मै सुदिनानि रायो दयुम्नान्य अर्यो वि दुरो अभि दयौत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāny asmai sudināni rāyo dyumnāny aryo vi duro abhi dyaut ||
Translation: All fair days and magnificence of riches hast thou beamed forth upon the good man's portals.

Sanskit Text: सेद अग्ने अस्तु सुभगः सुदानुर यस तवा नित्येन हविषा य उक्थैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sed aghne astu subhaghaḥ sudānur yas tvā nityena haviṣā ya ukthaiḥ |
Translation: 7 Blest, Agni, be the man, the liberal giver, who with his lauds and regular oblation

Sanskit Text: पिप्रीषति सव आयुषि दुरोणे विश्वेद अस्मै सुदिना सासद इष्टिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: piprīṣati sva āyuṣi duroṇe viśved asmai sudinā sāsad iṣṭiḥ ||
Translation: Is fain to please thee for his life and dwelling. May all his days be bright: be this his longing.

Sanskit Text: अर्चामि ते सुमतिं घोष्य अर्वाक सं ते वावाता जरताम इयं गीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arcāmi te sumatiṃ ghoṣy arvāk saṃ te vāvātā jaratām iyaṃ ghīḥ |
Translation: 8 I praise thy gracious favour: sing in answer. May this my song sing like a loved one with thee.

Sanskit Text: सवश्वास तवा सुरथा मर्जयेमास्मे कषत्राणि धारयेर अनु दयून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svaśvās tvā surathā marjayemāsme kṣatrāṇi dhārayer anu dyūn ||
Translation: Lords of good steeds and cars may we adorn thee, and day by day vouchsafe thou us dominion.

Sanskit Text: इह तवा भूर्य आ चरेद उप तमन दोषावस्तर दीदिवांसम अनु दयून |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iha tvā bhūry ā cared upa tman doṣāvastar dīdivāṃsam anu dyūn |
Translation: 9 Here of free choice let each one serve thee richly, resplendent day by day at eve and morning.

Sanskit Text: करीळन्तस तवा सुमनसः सपेमाभि दयुम्ना तस्थिवांसो जनानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: krīḷantas tvā sumanasaḥ sapemābhi dyumnā tasthivāṃso janānām ||
Translation: So may we honour thee, content and joyous, passing beyond the glories of the people.

Sanskit Text: यस तवा सवश्वः सुहिरण्यो अग्न उपयाति वसुमता रथेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yas tvā svaśvaḥ suhiraṇyo aghna upayāti vasumatā rathena |
Translation: 10 Whoso with good steeds and fine gold, O Agni, comes nigh thee on a car laden with treasure,

Sanskit Text: तस्य तराता भवसि तस्य सखा यस त आतिथ्यम आनुषग जुजोषत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya trātā bhavasi tasya sakhā yas ta ātithyam ānuṣagh jujoṣat ||
Translation: His Friend art thou, yea, thou art his Protector whose joy it is to entertain thee duly.

Sanskit Text: महो रुजामि बन्धुता वचोभिस तन मा पितुर गोतमाद अन्व इयाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: maho rujāmi bandhutā vacobhis tan mā pitur ghotamād anv iyāya |
Translation: 11 Through words and kinship I destroy the mighty: this power I have from Gotama my father.

Sanskit Text: तवं नो अस्य वचसश चिकिद्धि होतर यविष्ठ सुक्रतो दमूनाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ no asya vacasaś cikiddhi hotar yaviṣṭha sukrato damūnāḥ ||
Translation: Mark thou this speech of ours, O thou Most Youthful, Friend of the House, exceeding wise, Invoker.

Sanskit Text: अस्वप्नजस तरणयः सुशेवा अतन्द्रासो ऽवर्का अश्रमिष्ठाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asvapnajas taraṇayaḥ suśevā atandrāso 'vṛkā aśramiṣṭhāḥ |
Translation: 12 Knowing no slumber, speedy and propitious, alert and ever friendly, most unwearied,

Sanskit Text: ते पायवः सध्र्यञ्चो निषद्याग्ने तव नः पान्त्व अमूर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te pāyavaḥ sadhryañco niṣadyāghne tava naḥ pāntv amūra ||
Translation: May thy protecting powers, unerring Agni, taking their places here, combined, preserve us.

Sanskit Text: ये पायवो मामतेयं ते अग्ने पश्यन्तो अन्धं दुरिताद अरक्षन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye pāyavo māmateyaṃ te aghne paśyanto andhaṃ duritād arakṣan |
Translation: 13 Thy guardian rays, O Agni, when they saw him, preserved blind Māmateya from affliction.

Sanskit Text: ररक्ष तान सुक्र्तो विश्ववेदा दिप्सन्त इद रिपवो नाह देभुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rarakṣa tān sukṛto viśvavedā dipsanta id ripavo nāha debhuḥ ||
Translation: Lord of all riches, he preserved the pious: the fees who fain would harm them did no mischief

Sanskit Text: तवया वयं सधन्यस तवोतास तव परणीत्य अश्याम वाजान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā vayaṃ sadhanyas tvotās tava praṇīty aśyāma vājān |
Translation: 14 Aided by thee with thee may we be wealthy, may we gain strength with thee to guide us onward.

Sanskit Text: उभा शंसा सूदय सत्यताते ऽनुष्ठुया कर्णुह्य अह्रयाण ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhā śaṃsā sūdaya satyatāte 'nuṣṭhuyā kṛṇuhy ahrayāṇa ||
Translation: Fulfil the words of both, O Ever Truthful: straightway do this, thou God whom power emboldens.

Sanskit Text: अया ते अग्ने समिधा विधेम परति सतोमं शस्यमानं गर्भाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayā te aghne samidhā vidhema prati stomaṃ śasyamānaṃ ghṛbhāya |
Translation: 15 O Agni, with this fuel will we serve thee; accept the laud we sing to thee with favour

Sanskit Text: दहाशसो रक्षसः पाह्य अस्मान दरुहो निदो मित्रमहो अवद्यात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dahāśaso rakṣasaḥ pāhy asmān druho nido mitramaho avadyāt ||
Translation: Destroy the cursing Rākṣasas: preserve us, O rich in friends, from guile and scorn and slander.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्व ऊ षु णो अध्वरस्य होतर अग्ने तिष्ठ देवताता यजीयान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhva ū ṣu ṇo adhvarasya hotar aghne tiṣṭha devatātā yajīyān |
Translation: 1. PRIEST of our rite, stand up erect, O Agni, in the Gods’ service best of sacrificers,

Sanskit Text: तवं हि विश्वम अभ्य असि मन्म पर वेधसश चित तिरसि मनीषाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hi viśvam abhy asi manma pra vedhasaś cit tirasi manīṣām ||
Translation: For over evei y thought thou art the Ruler: thou furtherest e’en the wisdom of the pious.

Sanskit Text: अमूरो होता नय असादि विक्ष्व अग्निर मन्द्रो विदथेषु परचेताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: amūro hotā ny asādi vikṣv aghnir mandro vidatheṣu pracetāḥ |
Translation: 2 He was set down mid men as Priest unerring, Agni, wise, welcome in our holy synods.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वम भानुं सवितेवाश्रेन मेतेव धूमं सतभायद उप दयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvam bhānuṃ savitevāśren meteva dhūmaṃ stabhāyad upa dyām ||
Translation: Like Savitar he hath lifted up his splendour, and like a builder raised his smoke to heaven.

Sanskit Text: यता सुजूर्णी रातिनी घर्ताची परदक्षिणिद देवतातिम उराणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatā sujūrṇī rātinī ghṛtācī pradakṣiṇid devatātim urāṇaḥ |
Translation: 3 The glowing ladle, filled with oil, is lifted; choosing Gods’ service to the right he circles.

Sanskit Text: उद उ सवरुर नवजा नाक्रः पश्वो अनक्ति सुधितः सुमेकः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud u svarur navajā nākraḥ paśvo anakti sudhitaḥ sumekaḥ ||
Translation: Eager he rises like the new-wrought pillar which, firmly set and fixed, anoints the victims.

Sanskit Text: सतीर्णे बर्हिषि समिधाने अग्ना ऊर्ध्वो अध्वर्युर जुजुषाणो अस्थात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stīrṇe barhiṣi samidhāne aghnā ūrdhvo adhvaryur jujuṣāṇo asthāt |
Translation: 4 When sacred grass is strewn and Agni kindled, the Adhvaryu rises to, his task rejoicing.

Sanskit Text: पर्य अग्निः पशुपा न होता तरिविष्ट्य एति परदिव उराणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pary aghniḥ paśupā na hotā triviṣṭy eti pradiva urāṇaḥ ||
Translation: Agni the Priest, like one who tends the cattle, goes three times round, as from of old he wills it.

Sanskit Text: परि तमना मितद्रुर एति होताग्निर मन्द्रो मधुवचा रतावा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari tmanā mitadrur eti hotāghnir mandro madhuvacā ṛtāvā |
Translation: 5 Agni himself, the Priest, with measured motion, goes round, with sweet speech, cheerful, true to Order.

Sanskit Text: दरवन्त्य अस्य वाजिनो न शोका भयन्ते विश्वा भुवना यद अभ्राट ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dravanty asya vājino na śokā bhayante viśvā bhuvanā yad abhrāṭ ||
Translation: His fulgent flames run forth like vigorous horses; all creatures are affrighted when he blazes.

Sanskit Text: भद्रा ते अग्ने सवनीक संद्र्ग घोरस्य सतो विषुणस्य चारुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadrā te aghne svanīka saṃdṛgh ghorasya sato viṣuṇasya cāruḥ |
Translation: 6 Beautiful and auspicious is thine aspect, O lovely Agni, terrible when spreading.

Sanskit Text: न यत ते शोचिस तमसा वरन्त न धवस्मानस तन्व रेप आ धुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yat te śocis tamasā varanta na dhvasmānas tanv repa ā dhuḥ ||
Translation: Thy splendours are not covered by the darkness: detraction leaves no stain upon thy body.

Sanskit Text: न यस्य सातुर जनितोर अवारि न मातरापितरा नू चिद इष्टौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yasya sātur janitor avāri na mātarāpitarā nū cid iṣṭau |
Translation: 7 Naught hindered his production, Bounteous Giver: his Mother and his Sire were free to send him.

Sanskit Text: अधा मित्रो न सुधितः पावको ऽगनिर दीदाय मानुषीषु विक्षु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā mitro na sudhitaḥ pāvako 'ghnir dīdāya mānuṣīṣu vikṣu ||
Translation: Then as Friend benevolent, refulgent, Agni shone forth in human habitations.

Sanskit Text: दविर यम पञ्च जीजनन संवसानाः सवसारो अग्निम मानुषीषु विक्षु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvir yam pañca jījanan saṃvasānāḥ svasāro aghnim mānuṣīṣu vikṣu |
Translation: 8 He, Agni, whom the twice-five sisters, dwelling together, in the homes of men engendered,

Sanskit Text: उषर्बुधम अथर्यो न दन्तं शुक्रं सवासम परशुं न तिग्मम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣarbudham atharyo na dantaṃ śukraṃ svāsam paraśuṃ na tighmam ||
Translation: Bright like a spear's tooth, wakened in the morning, with powerful mouth and like an axe well-sharpened.

Sanskit Text: तव तये अग्ने हरितो घर्तस्ना रोहितास रज्वञ्चः सवञ्चः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava tye aghne harito ghṛtasnā rohitāsa ṛjvañcaḥ svañcaḥ |
Translation: 9 These thy Bay Coursers, Agni, dropping fatness, ruddy vigorous, speeding straightly forward,

Sanskit Text: अरुषासो वर्षण रजुमुष्का आ देवतातिम अह्वन्त दस्माः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aruṣāso vṛṣaṇa ṛjumuṣkā ā devatātim ahvanta dasmāḥ ||
Translation: And red steeds, wonderful, of mighty muscle, are to this service of the Gods invited:

Sanskit Text: ये ह तये ते सहमाना अयासस तवेषासो अग्ने अर्चयश चरन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye ha tye te sahamānā ayāsas tveṣāso aghne arcayaś caranti |
Translation: 10 These brightly-shining games of thine, O Agni, that move for ever restless, all-subduing,

Sanskit Text: शयेनासो न दुवसनासो अर्थं तुविष्वणसो मारुतं न शर्धः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śyenāso na duvasanāso arthaṃ tuviṣvaṇaso mārutaṃ na śardhaḥ ||
Translation: Like falcons hasting eagerly to the quarry, roar loudly like the army of the Maruts.

Sanskit Text: अकारि बरह्म समिधान तुभ्यं शंसात्य उक्थं यजते वय  धाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: akāri brahma samidhāna tubhyaṃ śaṃsāty ukthaṃ yajate vy  dhāḥ |
Translation: 11 To thee, O flaming God, hath prayer been offered. Let the priest laud thee: give to him who worships.

Sanskit Text: होतारम अग्निम मनुषो नि षेदुर नमस्यन्त उशिजः शंसम आयोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotāram aghnim manuṣo ni ṣedur namasyanta uśijaḥ śaṃsam āyoḥ ||
Translation: Men have established Agni as Invoker, fain to adore the glory of the living.

Sanskit Text: अयम इह परथमो धायि धात्र्भिर होता यजिष्ठो अध्वरेष्व ईड्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayam iha prathamo dhāyi dhātṛbhir hotā yajiṣṭho adhvareṣv īḍyaḥ |
Translation: 1. HERE by ordainers was this God appointed first Invoker, best at worship, to be praised at rites:

Sanskit Text: यम अप्नवानो भर्गवो विरुरुचुर वनेषु चित्रं विभ्वं विशे-विशे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yam apnavāno bhṛghavo virurucur vaneṣu citraṃ vibhvaṃ viśe-viśe ||
Translation: Whom Apnavāna, and the Bhṛgus caused to shine bright-coloured in the wood, spreading from home to home.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने कदा त आनुषग भुवद देवस्य चेतनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne kadā ta ānuṣagh bhuvad devasya cetanam |
Translation: 2 When shall thy glory as a God, Agni, be suddenly shown forth.

Sanskit Text: अधा हि तवा जग्र्भ्रिरे मर्तासो विक्ष्व ईड्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā hi tvā jaghṛbhrire martāso vikṣv īḍyam ||
Translation: For mortal men have held thee fast, adorable in all their homes,

Sanskit Text: रतावानं विचेतसम पश्यन्तो दयाम इव सत्र्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtāvānaṃ vicetasam paśyanto dyām iva stṛbhiḥ |
Translation: 3 Seeing thee faithful to the Law, most sapient, like the starry heaven,

Sanskit Text: विश्वेषाम अध्वराणां हस्कर्तारं दमे-दमे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśveṣām adhvarāṇāṃ haskartāraṃ dame-dame ||
Translation: Illumining with cheerful ray each solemn rite in every house.

Sanskit Text: आशुं दूतं विवस्वतो विश्वा यश चर्षणीर अभि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āśuṃ dūtaṃ vivasvato viśvā yaś carṣaṇīr abhi |
Translation: 4 Vivasvān's envoy living men have taken as their ensign, swift,

Sanskit Text: आ जभ्रुः केतुम आयवो भर्गवाणं विशे-विशे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā jabhruḥ ketum āyavo bhṛghavāṇaṃ viśe-viśe ||
Translation: The ruler over all mankind, moving like Bhṛgu in each home.

Sanskit Text: तम ईं होतारम आनुषक चिकित्वांसं नि षेदिरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tam īṃ hotāram ānuṣak cikitvāṃsaṃ ni ṣedire |
Translation: 5 Him the intelligent have they placed duly as Invoking Priest,

Sanskit Text: रण्वम पावकशोचिषं यजिष्ठं सप्त धामभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: raṇvam pāvakaśociṣaṃ yajiṣṭhaṃ sapta dhāmabhiḥ ||
