Translation: Welcome, with sanctifying flame, best worshipper, with sevenfold might;

Sanskit Text: तं शश्वतीषु मात्र्षु वन आ वीतम अश्रितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ śaśvatīṣu mātṛṣu vana ā vītam aśritam |
Translation: 6 In his Eternal Mothers, in the wood, concealed and unapproached,

Sanskit Text: चित्रं सन्तं गुहा हितं सुवेदं कूचिदर्थिनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: citraṃ santaṃ ghuhā hitaṃ suvedaṃ kūcidarthinam ||
Translation: Kept secret though his flames are bright seeking on all sides, quickly found.

Sanskit Text: ससस्य यद वियुता सस्मिन्न ऊधन्न रतस्य धामन रणयन्त देवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sasasya yad viyutā sasminn ūdhann ṛtasya dhāman raṇayanta devāḥ |
Translation: 7 That as food spreads forth in this earthly udder, Gods may rejoice them in the home of Order,

Sanskit Text: महां अग्निर नमसा रातहव्यो वेर अध्वराय सदम इद रतावा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahāṃ aghnir namasā rātahavyo ver adhvarāya sadam id ṛtāvā ||
Translation: Great Agni, served with reverence and oblation, flies ever to the sacrifice, the Faithful.

Sanskit Text: वेर अध्वरस्य दूत्यानि विद्वान उभे अन्ता रोदसी संचिकित्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ver adhvarasya dūtyāni vidvān ubhe antā rodasī saṃcikitvān |
Translation: 8 Bird of each rite, skilled in an envoy's duties, knowing both worlds and that which lies between them,

Sanskit Text: दूत ईयसे परदिव उराणो विदुष्टरो दिव आरोधनानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūta īyase pradiva urāṇo viduṣṭaro diva ārodhanāni ||
Translation: Thou goest from of old a willing Herald, knowing full well heaven's innermost recesses.

Sanskit Text: कर्ष्णं त एम रुशतः पुरो भाश चरिष्ण्व अर्चिर वपुषाम इद एकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṣṇaṃ ta ema ruśataḥ puro bhāś cariṣṇv arcir vapuṣām id ekam |
Translation: 9 Bright God, thy path is black: light is before thee: thy moving splendour is the chief of wonders.

Sanskit Text: यद अप्रवीता दधते ह गर्भं सद्यश चिज जातो भवसीद उ दूतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad apravītā dadhate ha gharbhaṃ sadyaś cij jāto bhavasīd u dūtaḥ ||
Translation: When she, yet unimpregnate, hath conceived thee, even when newly born thou art an envoy.

Sanskit Text: सद्यो जातस्य दद्र्शानम ओजो यद अस्य वातो अनुवाति शोचिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadyo jātasya dadṛśānam ojo yad asya vāto anuvāti śociḥ |
Translation: 10 Yet newly born, his vigour is apparent when the wind blows upon his fiery splendour,

Sanskit Text: वर्णक्ति तिग्माम अतसेषु जिह्वां सथिरा चिद अन्ना दयते वि जम्भैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṇakti tighmām ataseṣu jihvāṃ sthirā cid annā dayate vi jambhaiḥ ||
Translation: His sharpened tongue he layeth on the brushwood, and with his teeth e’en solid food consumeth.

Sanskit Text: तर्षु यद अन्ना तर्षुणा ववक्ष तर्षुं दूतं कर्णुते यह्वो अग्निः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tṛṣu yad annā tṛṣuṇā vavakṣa tṛṣuṃ dūtaṃ kṛṇute yahvo aghniḥ |
Translation: 11 When he hath borne off food with swift flame swiftly, strong Agni makes himself a speedy envoy,

Sanskit Text: वातस्य मेळिं सचते निजूर्वन्न आशुं न वाजयते हिन्वे अर्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vātasya meḷiṃ sacate nijūrvann āśuṃ na vājayate hinve arvā ||
Translation: Follows the rustling of the wind, consuming, and courser-like, speeds, drives the swift horse onward.

Sanskit Text: दूतं वो विश्ववेदसं हव्यवाहम अमर्त्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūtaṃ vo viśvavedasaṃ havyavāham amartyam |
Translation: 1. YOUR envoy who possesses all, Immortal, bearer of your gifts,

Sanskit Text: यजिष्ठम रञ्जसे गिरा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajiṣṭham ṛñjase ghirā ||
Translation: Best worshipper, I woo with song.

Sanskit Text: स हि वेदा वसुधितिम महां आरोधनं दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi vedā vasudhitim mahāṃ ārodhanaṃ divaḥ |
Translation: 2 He, Mighty, knows the gift of wealth, he knows the deep recess of heaven:

Sanskit Text: स देवां एह वक्षति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa devāṃ eha vakṣati ||
Translation: He shall bring hitherward the Gods.

Sanskit Text: स वेद देव आनमं देवां रतायते दमे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa veda deva ānamaṃ devāṃ ṛtāyate dame |
Translation: 3 He knows, a God himself, to guide Gods to the righteous in his home:

Sanskit Text: दाति परियाणि चिद वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dāti priyāṇi cid vasu ||
Translation: He gives e’en treasures that we love.

Sanskit Text: स होता सेद उ दूत्यं चिकित्वां अन्तर ईयते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hotā sed u dūtyaṃ cikitvāṃ antar īyate |
Translation: 4 He is the Herald: well-informed, he doth his errand to and fro,

Sanskit Text: विद्वां आरोधनं दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidvāṃ ārodhanaṃ divaḥ ||
Translation: Knowing the deep recess of heaven.

Sanskit Text: ते सयाम ये अग्नये ददाशुर हव्यदातिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te syāma ye aghnaye dadāśur havyadātibhiḥ |
Translation: 5 May we be they who gratify Agni with sacrificial gifts,

Sanskit Text: य ईम पुष्यन्त इन्धते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya īm puṣyanta indhate ||
Translation: Who cherish and enkindle him.

Sanskit Text: ते राया ते सुवीर्यैः ससवांसो वि शर्ण्विरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te rāyā te suvīryaiḥ sasavāṃso vi śṛṇvire |
Translation: 6 Illustrious for wealth are they, and hero deeds, victorious,

Sanskit Text: ये अग्ना दधिरे दुवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye aghnā dadhire duvaḥ ||
Translation: Who have served Agni reverently.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे रायो दिवे-दिवे सं चरन्तु पुरुस्प्र्हः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme rāyo dive-dive saṃ carantu puruspṛhaḥ |
Translation: 7 So unto us, day after day, may riches craved by many come,

Sanskit Text: अस्मे वाजास ईरताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme vājāsa īratām ||
Translation: And power and might spring up for us.

Sanskit Text: स विप्रश चर्षणीनां शवसा मानुषाणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vipraś carṣaṇīnāṃ śavasā mānuṣāṇām |
Translation: 8 That holy Singer in his strength shoots forth his arrows swifter than

Sanskit Text: अति कषिप्रेव विध्यति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ati kṣipreva vidhyati ||
Translation: The swift shafts of the tribes of men.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने मर्ळ महां असि य ईम आ देवयुं जनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne mṛḷa mahāṃ asi ya īm ā devayuṃ janam |
Translation: 1. AGNI, show favour: great art thou who to this pious man art come,

Sanskit Text: इयेथ बर्हिर आसदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyetha barhir āsadam ||
Translation: To seat thee on the sacred grass.

Sanskit Text: स मानुषीषु दूळभो विक्षु परावीर अमर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa mānuṣīṣu dūḷabho vikṣu prāvīr amartyaḥ |
Translation: 2 May he the Immortal, Helper, bard to be deceived among mankind,

Sanskit Text: दूतो विश्वेषाम भुवत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūto viśveṣām bhuvat ||
Translation: Become the messenger of all.

Sanskit Text: स सद्म परि णीयते होता मन्द्रो दिविष्टिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sadma pari ṇīyate hotā mandro diviṣṭiṣu |
Translation: 3 Around the altar is he led, welcome Chief Priest at solemn rites,

Sanskit Text: उत पोता नि षीदति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta potā ni ṣīdati ||
Translation: Or as the Potar sits him down.

Sanskit Text: उत गना अग्निर अध्वर उतो गर्हपतिर दमे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta ghnā aghnir adhvara uto ghṛhapatir dame |
Translation: 4 Agni in fire at sacrifice, and in the house as Lord thereof,

Sanskit Text: उत बरह्मा नि षीदति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta brahmā ni ṣīdati ||
Translation: And as a Brahman takes his seat.

Sanskit Text: वेषि हय अध्वरीयताम उपवक्ता जनानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: veṣi hy adhvarīyatām upavaktā janānām |
Translation: 5 Thou comest as the guide of folk who celebrate a sacrifice,

Sanskit Text: हव्या च मानुषाणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: havyā ca mānuṣāṇām ||
Translation: And to oblations brought by men.

Sanskit Text: वेषीद व अस्य दूत्यं यस्य जुजोषो अध्वरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: veṣīd v asya dūtyaṃ yasya jujoṣo adhvaram |
Translation: 6 Thou servest as his messenger whose sacrifice thou lovest well,

Sanskit Text: हव्यम मर्तस्य वोळ्हवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: havyam martasya voḷhave ||
Translation: To bear the mortal's gifts to heaven.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकं जोष्य अध्वरम अस्माकं यज्ञम अङगिरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākaṃ joṣy adhvaram asmākaṃ yajñam aṅghiraḥ |
Translation: 7 Accept our solemn rite; be pleased, Aṅgiras, with our sacrifice:

Sanskit Text: अस्माकं शर्णुधी हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākaṃ śṛṇudhī havam ||
Translation: Give ear and listen to our call.

Sanskit Text: परि ते दूळभो रथो ऽसमां अश्नोतु विश्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari te dūḷabho ratho 'smāṃ aśnotu viśvataḥ |
Translation: 8 May thine inviolable car, wherewith thou guardest those who give,

Sanskit Text: येन रक्षसि दाशुषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena rakṣasi dāśuṣaḥ ||
Translation: Come near to us from every side.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने तम अद्याश्वं न सतोमैः करतुं न भद्रं हर्दिस्प्र्शम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne tam adyāśvaṃ na stomaiḥ kratuṃ na bhadraṃ hṛdispṛśam |
Translation: 1. This day with praises, Agni, we bring thee that which thou lovest.

Sanskit Text: रध्यामा त ओहैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛdhyāmā ta ohaiḥ ||
Translation: Right judgment, like a horse, with our devotions.

Sanskit Text: अधा हय अग्ने करतोर भद्रस्य दक्षस्य साधोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā hy aghne krator bhadrasya dakṣasya sādhoḥ |
Translation: 2 For thou hast ever been the Car-driver, Agni, of noble

Sanskit Text: रथीर रतस्य बर्हतो बभूथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathīr ṛtasya bṛhato babhūtha ||
Translation: Strength, lofty sacrifice, and rightful judgment.

Sanskit Text: एभिर नो अर्कैर भवा नो अर्वाङ सवर ण जयोतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ebhir no arkair bhavā no arvāṅ svar ṇa jyotiḥ |
Translation: 3 Through these our praises come thou to meet us, bright as the sunlight,

Sanskit Text: अग्ने विश्वेभिः सुमना अनीकैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne viśvebhiḥ sumanā anīkaiḥ ||
Translation: O Agni, well disposed, with all thine aspects.

Sanskit Text: आभिष टे अद्य गीर्भिर गर्णन्तो ऽगने दाशेम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ābhiṣ ṭe adya ghīrbhir ghṛṇanto 'ghne dāśema |
Translation: 4 Now may we serve thee singing these lauds this day to thee, Agni.

Sanskit Text: पर ते दिवो न सतनयन्ति शुष्माः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te divo na stanayanti śuṣmāḥ ||
Translation: Loud as the voice of Heaven thy blasts are roaring.

Sanskit Text: तव सवादिष्ठाग्ने संद्र्ष्टिर इदा चिद अह्न इदा चिद अक्तोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava svādiṣṭhāghne saṃdṛṣṭir idā cid ahna idā cid aktoḥ |
Translation: 5 Just at this time of the day and the night thy look is the sweetest:

Sanskit Text: शरिये रुक्मो न रोचत उपाके ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śriye rukmo na rocata upāke ||
Translation: It shineth near us even as gold for glory.

Sanskit Text: घर्तं न पूतं तनूर अरेपाः शुचि हिरण्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtaṃ na pūtaṃ tanūr arepāḥ śuci hiraṇyam |
Translation: 6 Spotless thy body, brilliant as gold, like clarified butter:

Sanskit Text: तत ते रुक्मो न रोचत सवधावः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat te rukmo na rocata svadhāvaḥ ||
Translation: This gleams like gold on thee, O Self. dependent.

Sanskit Text: कर्तं चिद धि षमा सनेमि दवेषो ऽगन इनोषि मर्तात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛtaṃ cid dhi ṣmā sanemi dveṣo 'ghna inoṣi martāt |
Translation: 7 All hate and mischief, yea, if committed, Agni, thou turnest,

Sanskit Text: इत्था यजमानाद रतावः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: itthā yajamānād ṛtāvaḥ ||
Translation: Holy One, from the man who rightly worships.

Sanskit Text: शिवा नः सख्या सन्तु भरात्राग्ने देवेषु युष्मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śivā naḥ sakhyā santu bhrātrāghne deveṣu yuṣme |
Translation: 8 Agni, with you Gods, prosperous be our friendships and kinships.

Sanskit Text: सा नो नाभिः सदने सस्मिन्न ऊधन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā no nābhiḥ sadane sasminn ūdhan ||
Translation: Be this our bond here by this place, thine altar.

Sanskit Text: भद्रं ते अग्ने सहसिन्न अनीकम उपाक आ रोचते सूर्यस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadraṃ te aghne sahasinn anīkam upāka ā rocate sūryasya |
Translation: 1. THY blessed majesty, victorious Agni, shines brightly in the neighbourhood of Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: रुशद दर्शे दद्र्शे नक्तया चिद अरूक्षितं दर्श आ रूपे अन्नम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ruśad dṛśe dadṛśe naktayā cid arūkṣitaṃ dṛśa ā rūpe annam ||
Translation: Splendid to see, it shows even at nighttime, and food is fair to look on in thy beauty.

Sanskit Text: वि षाह्य अग्ने गर्णते मनीषां खं वेपसा तुविजात सतवानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi ṣāhy aghne ghṛṇate manīṣāṃ khaṃ vepasā tuvijāta stavānaḥ |
Translation: 2 Agni, disclose his thought for him who singeth, the well, Strong God! while thou art praised with fervour.

Sanskit Text: विश्वेभिर यद वावनः शुक्र देवैस तन नो रास्व सुमहो भूरि मन्म ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvebhir yad vāvanaḥ śukra devais tan no rāsva sumaho bhūri manma ||
Translation: Vouchsafe to us that powerful hymn, O Mighty, which, Radiant One! with all the Gods thou lovest.

Sanskit Text: तवद अग्ने काव्या तवन मनीषास तवद उक्था जायन्ते राध्यानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvad aghne kāvyā tvan manīṣās tvad ukthā jāyante rādhyāni |
Translation: 3 From thee, O Agni, springs poetic wisdom, from thee come thoughts and hymns of praise that prosper;

Sanskit Text: तवद एति दरविणं वीरपेशा इत्थाधिये दाशुषे मर्त्याय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvad eti draviṇaṃ vīrapeśā itthādhiye dāśuṣe martyāya ||
Translation: From thee flows wealth, with heroes to adorn it, to the true-hearted man who gives oblation.

Sanskit Text: तवद वाजी वाजम्भरो विहाया अभिष्टिक्र्ज जायते सत्यशुष्मः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvad vājī vājambharo vihāyā abhiṣṭikṛj jāyate satyaśuṣmaḥ |
Translation: 4 From thee the hero springs who wins the booty, bringer of help, mighty, of real courage.

Sanskit Text: तवद रयिर देवजूतो मयोभुस तवद आशुर जूजुवां अग्ने अर्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvad rayir devajūto mayobhus tvad āśur jūjuvāṃ aghne arvā ||
Translation: From thee comes wealth, sent by the Gods, bliss-giving; Agni, from thee the fleet impetuous charger.

Sanskit Text: तवाम अग्ने परथमं देवयन्तो देवम मर्ता अम्र्त मन्द्रजिह्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvām aghne prathamaṃ devayanto devam martā amṛta mandrajihvam |
Translation: 5 Immortal Agni, thee whose voice is pleasant, as first in rank, as God, religious mortals

Sanskit Text: दवेषोयुतम आ विवासन्ति धीभिर दमूनसं गर्हपतिम अमूरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dveṣoyutam ā vivāsanti dhībhir damūnasaṃ ghṛhapatim amūram ||
Translation: Invite with hymns; thee who removest hatred, Friend of the Home, the household's Lord, unerring.

Sanskit Text: आरे अस्मद अमतिम आरे अंह आरे विश्वां दुर्मतिं यन निपासि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āre asmad amatim āre aṃha āre viśvāṃ durmatiṃ yan nipāsi |
Translation: 6 Far from us thou removest want and sorrow, far from us all ill-will when thou protectest.

Sanskit Text: दोषा शिवः सहसः सूनो अग्ने यं देव आ चित सचसे सवस्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: doṣā śivaḥ sahasaḥ sūno aghne yaṃ deva ā cit sacase svasti ||
Translation: Son of Strength, Agni, blest is he at evening, whom thou as God attendest for his welfare.

Sanskit Text: यस तवाम अग्न इनधते यतस्रुक तरिस ते अन्नं कर्णवत सस्मिन्न अहन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yas tvām aghna inadhate yatasruk tris te annaṃ kṛṇavat sasminn ahan |
Translation: 1. WHOSO enkindles thee, with lifted ladle, and thrice this day offers thee food, O Agni,

Sanskit Text: स सु दयुम्नैर अभ्य अस्तु परसक्षत तव करत्वा जातवेदश चिकित्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa su dyumnair abhy astu prasakṣat tava kratvā jātavedaś cikitvān ||
Translation: May he excel, triumphant through thy splendours, wise through thy mental power, O Jātavedas.

Sanskit Text: इध्मं यस ते जभरच छश्रमाणो महो अग्ने अनीकम आ सपर्यन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idhmaṃ yas te jabharac chaśramāṇo maho aghne anīkam ā saparyan |
Translation: 2 Whoso with toil and trouble brings thee fuel, serving the majesty of mighty Agni,

Sanskit Text: स इधानः परति दोषाम उषासम पुष्यन रयिं सचते घनन्न अमित्रान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa idhānaḥ prati doṣām uṣāsam puṣyan rayiṃ sacate ghnann amitrān ||
Translation: He, kindling thee at evening and at morning, prospers, and comes to wealth, and slays his foemen.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर ईशे बर्हतः कषत्रियस्याग्निर वाजस्य परमस्य रायः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnir īśe bṛhataḥ kṣatriyasyāghnir vājasya paramasya rāyaḥ |
Translation: 3 Agni is Master of sublime dominion, Agni is Lord of strength and lofty riches.

Sanskit Text: दधाति रत्नं विधते यविष्ठो वय आनुषङ मर्त्याय सवधावान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhāti ratnaṃ vidhate yaviṣṭho vy ānuṣaṅ martyāya svadhāvān ||
Translation: Straightway the self-reliant God, Most Youthful, gives treasures to the mortal who adores him.

Sanskit Text: यच चिद धि ते पुरुषत्रा यविष्ठाचित्तिभिश चक्र्मा कच चिद आगः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yac cid dhi te puruṣatrā yaviṣṭhācittibhiś cakṛmā kac cid āghaḥ |
Translation: 4 Most Youthful God, whatever sin, through folly, we here, as human beings, have committed,

Sanskit Text: कर्धी षव अस्मां अदितेर अनागान वय एनांसि शिश्रथो विष्वग अग्ने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛdhī ṣv asmāṃ aditer anāghān vy enāṃsi śiśratho viṣvagh aghne ||
Translation: In sight of Aditi make thou us sinless remit, entirely, Agni, our offences.

Sanskit Text: महश चिद अग्न एनसो अभीक ऊर्वाद देवानाम उत मर्त्यानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahaś cid aghna enaso abhīka ūrvād devānām uta martyānām |
Translation: 5 Even in the presence of great sin, O Agni, free us from prison of the Gods or mortals.

Sanskit Text: मा ते सखायः सदम इद रिषाम यछा तोकाय तनयाय शं योः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā te sakhāyaḥ sadam id riṣāma yachā tokāya tanayāya śaṃ yoḥ ||
Translation: Never may we who are thy friends be injured: grant health and strength unto our seed and offspring.

Sanskit Text: यथा ह तयद वसवो गौर्यं चित पदि षिताम अमुञ्चता यजत्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā ha tyad vasavo ghauryaṃ cit padi ṣitām amuñcatā yajatrāḥ |
Translation: 6 Even as ye here, Gods Excellent and Holy, have loosed the cow that by the foot was tethered,

Sanskit Text: एवो षव अस्मन मुञ्चता वय अंहः पर तार्य अग्ने परतरं न आयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evo ṣv asman muñcatā vy aṃhaḥ pra tāry aghne prataraṃ na āyuḥ ||
Translation: So also set us free from this affliction long let our life, O Agni, be extended.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर होता नो अध्वरे वाजी सन परि णीयते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnir hotā no adhvare vājī san pari ṇīyate |
Translation: 1. AGNI the Herald, like a horse, is led forth at our solemn rite,

Sanskit Text: देवो देवेषु यज्ञियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devo deveṣu yajñiyaḥ ||
Translation: God among Gods adorable.

Sanskit Text: परि तरिविष्ट्य अध्वरं यात्य अग्नी रथीर इव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari triviṣṭy adhvaraṃ yāty aghnī rathīr iva |
Translation: 2 Three times unto our solemn rite comes Agni like a charioteer,

Sanskit Text: आ देवेषु परयो दधत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā deveṣu prayo dadhat ||
Translation: Bearing the viands to the Gods.

Sanskit Text: परि वाजपतिः कविर अग्निर हव्यान्य अक्रमीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari vājapatiḥ kavir aghnir havyāny akramīt |
Translation: 3 Round the oblations hath he paced, Agni the Wise, the Lord of Strength,

Sanskit Text: दधद रत्नानि दाशुषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhad ratnāni dāśuṣe ||
Translation: Giving the offerer precious boons.

Sanskit Text: अयं यः सर्ञ्जये पुरो दैववाते समिध्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ yaḥ sṛñjaye puro daivavāte samidhyate |
Translation: 4 He who is kindled eastward for Sṛñjaya, Devāvata's son,

Sanskit Text: दयुमां अमित्रदम्भनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyumāṃ amitradambhanaḥ ||
Translation: Resplendent, tamer of the foe.

Sanskit Text: अस्य घा वीर ईवतो ऽगनेर ईशीत मर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya ghā vīra īvato 'ghner īśīta martyaḥ |
Translation: 5 So mighty be the Agni whom the mortal hero shall command,

Sanskit Text: तिग्मजम्भस्य मीळ्हुषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tighmajambhasya mīḷhuṣaḥ ||
Translation: With sharpened teeth and bountiful.

Sanskit Text: तम अर्वन्तं न सानसिम अरुषं न दिवः शिशुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tam arvantaṃ na sānasim aruṣaṃ na divaḥ śiśum |
Translation: 6 Day after day they dress him, as they clean a horse who wins the prize.

Sanskit Text: मर्म्र्ज्यन्ते दिवे-दिवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: marmṛjyante dive-dive ||
Translation: Dress the red Scion of the Sky.

Sanskit Text: बोधद यन मा हरिभ्यां कुमारः साहदेव्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bodhad yan mā haribhyāṃ kumāraḥ sāhadevyaḥ |
Translation: 7 When Sahadeva's princely son with two bay horses thought of me,

Sanskit Text: अछा न हूत उद अरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā na hūta ud aram ||
Translation: Summoned by him I drew not back.

Sanskit Text: उत तया यजता हरी कुमारात साहदेव्यात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tyā yajatā harī kumārāt sāhadevyāt |
Translation: 8 And truly those two noble bays I straightway took when offered me,

Sanskit Text: परयता सद्य आ ददे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prayatā sadya ā dade ||
Translation: From Sahadeva's princely son.

Sanskit Text: एष वां देवाव अश्विना कुमारः साहदेव्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa vāṃ devāv aśvinā kumāraḥ sāhadevyaḥ |
Translation: 9 Long, O ye Aśvins, may he live, your care, ye Gods, the princely son.

Sanskit Text: दीर्घायुर अस्तु सोमकः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dīrghāyur astu somakaḥ ||
Translation: Of Sahadeva, Somaka.

Sanskit Text: तं युवं देवाव अश्विना कुमारं साहदेव्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ yuvaṃ devāv aśvinā kumāraṃ sāhadevyam |
Translation: 10 Cause him the youthful prince, the son of Sahadeva, to enjoy

Sanskit Text: दीर्घायुषं कर्णोतन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dīrghāyuṣaṃ kṛṇotana ||
Translation: Long life, O Aśvins, O ye Gods.

Sanskit Text: आ सत्यो यातु मघवां रजीषी दरवन्त्व अस्य हरय उप नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā satyo yātu maghavāṃ ṛjīṣī dravantv asya haraya upa naḥ |
Translation: 1. IMPETUOUS, true, let Maghavan come hither, and let his Tawny Coursers speed to reach us.

Sanskit Text: तस्मा इद अन्धः सुषुमा सुदक्षम इहाभिपित्वं करते गर्णानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmā id andhaḥ suṣumā sudakṣam ihābhipitvaṃ karate ghṛṇānaḥ ||
Translation: For him have we pressed juice exceeding potent: here, praised with song, let him effect his visit.

Sanskit Text: अव सय शूराध्वनो नान्ते ऽसमिन नो अद्य सवने मन्दध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava sya śūrādhvano nānte 'smin no adya savane mandadhyai |
Translation: 2 Unyoke, as at thy journey's end, O Hero, to gladden thee today at this libation.

Sanskit Text: शंसात्य उक्थम उशनेव वेधाश चिकितुषे असुर्याय मन्म ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃsāty uktham uśaneva vedhāś cikituṣe asuryāya manma ||
Translation: Like Uśanā, the priest a laud shall utter, a hymn to thee, the Lord Divine, who markest.

Sanskit Text: कविर न निण्यं विदथानि साधन वर्षा यत सेकं विपिपानो अर्चात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kavir na niṇyaṃ vidathāni sādhan vṛṣā yat sekaṃ vipipāno arcāt |
Translation: 3 When the Bull, quaffing, praises our libation, as a sage paying holy rites in secret,

Sanskit Text: दिव इत्था जीजनत सप्त कारून अह्ना चिच चक्रुर वयुना गर्णन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: diva itthā jījanat sapta kārūn ahnā cic cakrur vayunā ghṛṇantaḥ ||
Translation: Seven singers here from heaven hath he begotten, who e’en by day have wrought their works while singing.

Sanskit Text: सवर यद वेदि सुद्र्शीकम अर्कैर महि जयोती रुरुचुर यद ध वस्तोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svar yad vedi sudṛśīkam arkair mahi jyotī rurucur yad dha vastoḥ |
Translation: 4 When heaven's fair light by hymns was made apparent (they made great splendour shine at break of morning),

Sanskit Text: अन्धा तमांसि दुधिता विचक्षे नर्भ्यश चकार नर्तमो अभिष्टौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: andhā tamāṃsi dudhitā vicakṣe nṛbhyaś cakāra nṛtamo abhiṣṭau ||
Translation: He with his succour, best of Heroes, scattered the blinding darkness so that men saw clearly.

Sanskit Text: ववक्ष इन्द्रो अमितम रजीष्य उभे आ पप्रौ रोदसी महित्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vavakṣa indro amitam ṛjīṣy ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā |
Translation: 5 Indra, Impetuous One, hath waxed immensely: he with his vastness hath filled earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: अतश चिद अस्य महिमा वि रेच्य अभि यो विश्वा भुवना बभूव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ataś cid asya mahimā vi recy abhi yo viśvā bhuvanā babhūva ||
Translation: E’en beyond this his majesty extendeth who hath exceeded all the worlds in greatness.

Sanskit Text: विश्वानि शक्रो नर्याणि विद्वान अपो रिरेच सखिभिर निकामैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāni śakro naryāṇi vidvān apo rireca sakhibhir nikāmaiḥ |
Translation: 6 Śakra who knoweth well all human actions hath with his eager Friends let loose the waters.

Sanskit Text: अश्मानं चिद ये बिभिदुर वचोभिर वरजं गोमन्तम उशिजो वि वव्रुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśmānaṃ cid ye bibhidur vacobhir vrajaṃ ghomantam uśijo vi vavruḥ ||
Translation: They with their songs cleft e’en the mountain open and willingly disclosed the stall of cattle.

Sanskit Text: अपो वर्त्रं वव्रिवांसम पराहन परावत ते वज्रम पर्थिवी सचेताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apo vṛtraṃ vavrivāṃsam parāhan prāvat te vajram pṛthivī sacetāḥ |
Translation: 7 He smote away the floods' obstructer, Vṛtra; Earth, conscious, lent her aid to speed thy thunder.

Sanskit Text: परार्णांसि समुद्रियाण्य ऐनोः पतिर भवञ छवसा शूर धर्ष्णो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prārṇāṃsi samudriyāṇy ainoḥ patir bhavañ chavasā śūra dhṛṣṇo ||
Translation: Thou sentest forth the waters of the ocean, as Lord through power and might, O daring Hero.

Sanskit Text: अपो यद अद्रिम पुरुहूत दर्दर आविर भुवत सरमा पूर्व्यं ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apo yad adrim puruhūta dardar āvir bhuvat saramā pūrvyaṃ te |
Translation: 8 When, Much-invoked! the water's rock thou cleftest, Saramā showed herself and went before thee.

Sanskit Text: स नो नेता वाजम आ दर्षि भूरिं गोत्रा रुजन्न अङगिरोभिर गर्णानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no netā vājam ā darṣi bhūriṃ ghotrā rujann aṅghirobhir ghṛṇānaḥ ||
Translation: Hymned by Aṅgirases, bursting the cow-stalls, much strength thou foundest for us as our leader.

Sanskit Text: अछा कविं नर्मणो गा अभिष्टौ सवर्षाता मघवन नाधमानम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā kaviṃ nṛmaṇo ghā abhiṣṭau svarṣātā maghavan nādhamānam |
Translation: 9 Come, Maghavan, Friend of Man, to aid the singer imploring thee in battle for the sunlight.

Sanskit Text: ऊतिभिस तम इषणो दयुम्नहूतौ नि मायावान अब्रह्मा दस्युर अर्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūtibhis tam iṣaṇo dyumnahūtau ni māyāvān abrahmā dasyur arta ||
Translation: Speed him with help in his inspired invokings: down sink the sorcerer, the prayerless Dasyu.

Sanskit Text: आ दस्युघ्ना मनसा याह्य अस्तम भुवत ते कुत्सः सख्ये निकामः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā dasyughnā manasā yāhy astam bhuvat te kutsaḥ sakhye nikāmaḥ |
Translation: 10 Come to our home resolved to slay the Dasyu: Kutsa longed eagerly to win thy friendship.

Sanskit Text: सवे योनौ नि षदतं सरूपा वि वां चिकित्सद रतचिद ध नारी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sve yonau ni ṣadataṃ sarūpā vi vāṃ cikitsad ṛtacid dha nārī ||
Translation: Alike in form ye both sate in his dwelling the faithful Lady was in doubt between you.

Sanskit Text: यासि कुत्सेन सरथम अवस्युस तोदो वातस्य हर्योर ईशानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāsi kutsena saratham avasyus todo vātasya haryor īśānaḥ |
Translation: 11 Thou comest, fain to succour him, with Kutsa,—a goad that masters both the Wind-God's horses,

Sanskit Text: रज्रा वाजं न गध्यं युयूषन कविर यद अहन पार्याय भूषात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛjrā vājaṃ na ghadhyaṃ yuyūṣan kavir yad ahan pāryāya bhūṣāt ||
Translation: That, holding the brown steeds like spoil for capture, the sage may on the final day be present.

Sanskit Text: कुत्साय शुष्णम अशुषं नि बर्हीः परपित्वे अह्नः कुयवं सहस्रा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kutsāya śuṣṇam aśuṣaṃ ni barhīḥ prapitve ahnaḥ kuyavaṃ sahasrā |
Translation: 12 For Kutsa, with thy thousand, thou at day-break didst hurl down greedy Śuṣṇa, foe of harvest.

Sanskit Text: सद्यो दस्यून पर मर्ण कुत्स्येन पर सूरश चक्रं वर्हताद अभीके ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadyo dasyūn pra mṛṇa kutsyena pra sūraś cakraṃ vṛhatād abhīke ||
Translation: Quickly with Kutsa's friend destroy the Dasyus, and roll the chariot-wheel of Sūrya near us.

Sanskit Text: तवम पिप्रुम मर्गयं शूशुवांसम रजिश्वने वैदथिनाय रन्धीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvam piprum mṛghayaṃ śūśuvāṃsam ṛjiśvane vaidathināya randhīḥ |
Translation: 13 Thou to the son of Vidathin, Ṛjiśvan, gavest up mighty Mṛgaya and Pipru.

Sanskit Text: पञ्चाशत कर्ष्णा नि वपः सहस्रात्कं न पुरो जरिमा वि दर्दः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pañcāśat kṛṣṇā ni vapaḥ sahasrātkaṃ na puro jarimā vi dardaḥ ||
Translation: Thou smotest down the swarthy fifty thousand, and rentest forts as age consumes a garment.

Sanskit Text: सूर उपाके तन्वं दधानो वि यत ते चेत्य अम्र्तस्य वर्पः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūra upāke tanvaṃ dadhāno vi yat te cety amṛtasya varpaḥ |
Translation: 14 What time thou settest near the Sun thy body, thy form, Immortal One, is seen expanding:

Sanskit Text: मर्गो न हस्ती तविषीम उषाणः सिंहो न भीम आयुधानि बिभ्रत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mṛgho na hastī taviṣīm uṣāṇaḥ siṃho na bhīma āyudhāni bibhrat ||
Translation: Thou a wild elephant with might invested. like a dread lion as thou wieldest weapons.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं कामा वसूयन्तो अग्मन सवर्मीळ्हे न सवने चकानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ kāmā vasūyanto aghman svarmīḷhe na savane cakānāḥ |
Translation: 15 Wishes for wealth have gone to Indra, longing for him in war for light and at libation,

Sanskit Text: शरवस्यवः शशमानास उक्थैर ओको न रण्वा सुद्र्शीव पुष्टिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śravasyavaḥ śaśamānāsa ukthair oko na raṇvā sudṛśīva puṣṭiḥ ||
Translation: Eager for glory, labouring with praisesongs: he is like home, like sweet and fair nutrition.

Sanskit Text: तम इद व इन्द्रं सुहवं हुवेम यस ता चकार नर्या पुरूणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tam id va indraṃ suhavaṃ huvema yas tā cakāra naryā purūṇi |
Translation: 16 Call we for you that Indra, prompt to listen, him who hath done so much for men's advantage;

Sanskit Text: यो मावते जरित्रे गध्यं चिन मक्षू वाजम भरति सपार्हराधाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo māvate jaritre ghadhyaṃ cin makṣū vājam bharati spārharādhāḥ ||
Translation: Who, Lord of envied bounty, to a singer like me brings quickly booty worth the capture.

Sanskit Text: तिग्मा यद अन्तर अशनिः पताति कस्मिञ चिच छूर मुहुके जनानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tighmā yad antar aśaniḥ patāti kasmiñ cic chūra muhuke janānām |
Translation: 17 When the sharp-pointed arrow, O thou Hero, flieth mid any conflict of the people,

Sanskit Text: घोरा यद अर्य सम्र्तिर भवात्य अध समा नस तन्वो बोधि गोपाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghorā yad arya samṛtir bhavāty adha smā nas tanvo bodhi ghopāḥ ||
Translation: When, Faithful One, the dread encounter cometh, then be thou the Protector of our body.

Sanskit Text: भुवो ऽविता वामदेवस्य धीनाम भुवः सखाव्र्को वाजसातौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhuvo 'vitā vāmadevasya dhīnām bhuvaḥ sakhāvṛko vājasātau |
Translation: 18 Further the holy thoughts of Vamadeva be thou a guileless Friend in fight for booty.

Sanskit Text: तवाम अनु परमतिम आ जगन्मोरुशंसो जरित्रे विश्वध सयाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvām anu pramatim ā jaghanmoruśaṃso jaritre viśvadha syāḥ ||
Translation: We come to thee whose providence protects us: wide be thy sway for ever for thy singer.

Sanskit Text: एभिर नर्भिर इन्द्र तवायुभिष टवा मघवद्भिर मघवन विश्व आजौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ebhir nṛbhir indra tvāyubhiṣ ṭvā maghavadbhir maghavan viśva ājau |
Translation: 19 O Indra, with these men who love thee truly, free givers, Maghavan, in every battle,

Sanskit Text: दयावो न दयुम्नैर अभि सन्तो अर्यः कषपो मदेम शरदश च पूर्वीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyāvo na dyumnair abhi santo aryaḥ kṣapo madema śaradaś ca pūrvīḥ ||
Translation: May we rejoice through many autumns, quelling our foes, as days subdue the nights with splendour.

Sanskit Text: एवेद इन्द्राय वर्षभाय वर्ष्णे बरह्माकर्म भर्गवो न रथम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eved indrāya vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe brahmākarma bhṛghavo na ratham |
Translation: 20 Now, as the Bhṛgus wrought a car, for Indra the Strong, the Mighty, we our prayer have fashioned,

Sanskit Text: नू चिद यथा नः सख्या वियोषद असन न उग्रो ऽविता तनूपाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū cid yathā naḥ sakhyā viyoṣad asan na ughro 'vitā tanūpāḥ ||
Translation: That he may, ne’er withdraw from us his friendship, but be our bodies' guard and strong defender.

Sanskit Text: नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū ṣṭuta indra nū ghṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ |
Translation: 21 Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell. high like rivers for the singer.

Sanskit Text: अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ ||
Translation: For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

Sanskit Text: तवम महां इन्द्र तुभ्यं ह कषा अनु कषत्रम मंहना मन्यत दयौः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvam mahāṃ indra tubhyaṃ ha kṣā anu kṣatram maṃhanā manyata dyauḥ |
Translation: 1. GREAT art thou, Indra; yea, the earth, with gladness, and heaven confess to thee thine high dominion.

Sanskit Text: तवं वर्त्रं शवसा जघन्वान सर्जः सिन्धूंर अहिना जग्रसानान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ vṛtraṃ śavasā jaghanvān sṛjaḥ sindhūṃr ahinā jaghrasānān ||
Translation: Thou in thy vigour having slaughtered Vṛtra didst free the floods arrested by the Dragon.

Sanskit Text: तव तविषो जनिमन रेजत दयौ रेजद भूमिर भियसा सवस्य मन्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava tviṣo janiman rejata dyau rejad bhūmir bhiyasā svasya manyoḥ |
Translation: 2 Heaven trembled at the birth of thine effulgence; Earth trembled at the fear of thy displeasure.

Sanskit Text: रघायन्त सुभ्वः पर्वतास आर्दन धन्वानि सरयन्त आपः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛghāyanta subhvaḥ parvatāsa ārdan dhanvāni sarayanta āpaḥ ||
Translation: The stedfast mountains shook in agitation . the waters flowed, and desert spots were flooded.

Sanskit Text: भिनद गिरिं शवसा वज्रम इष्णन्न आविष्क्र्ण्वानः सहसान ओजः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhinad ghiriṃ śavasā vajram iṣṇann āviṣkṛṇvānaḥ sahasāna ojaḥ |
Translation: 3 Hurling his bolt with might he cleft the mountain, while, putting forth his strength, he showed his vigour.

Sanskit Text: वधीद वर्त्रं वज्रेण मन्दसानः सरन्न आपो जवसा हतव्र्ष्णीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vadhīd vṛtraṃ vajreṇa mandasānaḥ sarann āpo javasā hatavṛṣṇīḥ ||
Translation: He slaughtered Vṛtra with his bolt, exulting, and, their lord slain, forth flowed the waters swiftly.

Sanskit Text: सुवीरस ते जनिता मन्यत दयौर इन्द्रस्य कर्ता सवपस्तमो भूत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvīras te janitā manyata dyaur indrasya kartā svapastamo bhūt |
Translation: 4 Thy Father Dyaus esteemed himself a hero: most noble was the work of Indra's Maker,

Sanskit Text: य ईं जजान सवर्यं सुवज्रम अनपच्युतं सदसो न भूम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya īṃ jajāna svaryaṃ suvajram anapacyutaṃ sadaso na bhūma ||
Translation: His who begat the strong bolt's Lord who roareth, immovable like earth from her foundation.

Sanskit Text: य एक इच चयावयति पर भूमा राजा कर्ष्टीनाम पुरुहूत इन्द्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya eka ic cyāvayati pra bhūmā rājā kṛṣṭīnām puruhūta indraḥ |
Translation: 5 He who alone o’erthrows the world of creatures, Indra the peoples' King, invoked of many-

Sanskit Text: सत्यम एनम अनु विश्वे मदन्ति रातिं देवस्य गर्णतो मघोनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satyam enam anu viśve madanti rātiṃ devasya ghṛṇato maghonaḥ ||
Translation: Verily all rejoice in him, extolling the boons which Maghavan the God hath sent them.

Sanskit Text: सत्रा सोमा अभवन्न अस्य विश्वे सत्रा मदासो बर्हतो मदिष्ठाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satrā somā abhavann asya viśve satrā madāso bṛhato madiṣṭhāḥ |
Translation: 6 All Soma juices are his own for ever, most gladdening draughts are ever his, the Mighty,

Sanskit Text: सत्राभवो वसुपतिर वसूनां दत्रे विश्वा अधिथा इन्द्र कर्ष्टीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satrābhavo vasupatir vasūnāṃ datre viśvā adhithā indra kṛṣṭīḥ ||
Translation: Thou ever wast the Treasure-Lord of treasures: Indra, thou lettest all folk share thy bounty.

Sanskit Text: तवम अध परथमं जायमानो ऽमे विश्वा अधिथा इन्द्र कर्ष्टीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvam adha prathamaṃ jāyamāno 'me viśvā adhithā indra kṛṣṭīḥ |
Translation: 7 Moreover, when thou first wast born, O Indra, thou struckest terror into all the people.

Sanskit Text: तवम परति परवत आशयानम अहिं वज्रेण मघवन वि वर्श्चः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvam prati pravata āśayānam ahiṃ vajreṇa maghavan vi vṛścaḥ ||
Translation: Thou, Maghavan, rentest with thy bolt the Dragon who lay against the waterfloods of heaven.

Sanskit Text: सत्राहणं दाध्र्षिं तुम्रम इन्द्रम महाम अपारं वर्षभं सुवज्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satrāhaṇaṃ dādhṛṣiṃ tumram indram mahām apāraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ suvajram |
Translation: 8 The ever-slaying, bold and furious Indra, the bright bolt's Lord, infinite, strong and mighty,

Sanskit Text: हन्ता यो वर्त्रं सनितोत वाजं दाता मघानि मघवा सुराधाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hantā yo vṛtraṃ sanitota vājaṃ dātā maghāni maghavā surādhāḥ ||
Translation: Who slayeth Vṛtra and acquireth booty, giver of blessings, Maghavan the bounteous:

Sanskit Text: अयं वर्तश चातयते समीचीर य आजिषु मघवा शर्ण्व एकः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ vṛtaś cātayate samīcīr ya ājiṣu maghavā śṛṇva ekaḥ |
Translation: 9 Alone renowned as Maghavan in battles, he frighteneth away assembled armies.

Sanskit Text: अयं वाजम भरति यं सनोत्य अस्य परियासः सख्ये सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ vājam bharati yaṃ sanoty asya priyāsaḥ sakhye syāma ||
Translation: He bringeth us the booty that he winneth may we, well-loved, continue in his friendship.

Sanskit Text: अयं शर्ण्वे अध जयन्न उत घनन्न अयम उत पर कर्णुते युधा गाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ śṛṇve adha jayann uta ghnann ayam uta pra kṛṇute yudhā ghāḥ |
Translation: 10 Renowned is he when conquering and when slaying: 'fis he who winneth cattle in the combat.

Sanskit Text: यदा सत्यं कर्णुते मन्युम इन्द्रो विश्वं दर्ळ्हम भयत एजद अस्मात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā satyaṃ kṛṇute manyum indro viśvaṃ dṛḷham bhayata ejad asmāt ||
Translation: When Indra hardeneth his indignation all that is fixed and all that moveth fear him.

Sanskit Text: सम इन्द्रो गा अजयत सं हिरण्या सम अश्विया मघवा यो ह पूर्वीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sam indro ghā ajayat saṃ hiraṇyā sam aśviyā maghavā yo ha pūrvīḥ |
Translation: 11 Indra hath won all kine, all gold, all horses,—Maghavan, he who breaketh forts in pieces;

Sanskit Text: एभिर नर्भिर नर्तमो अस्य शाकै रायो विभक्ता सम्भरश च वस्वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ebhir nṛbhir nṛtamo asya śākai rāyo vibhaktā sambharaś ca vasvaḥ ||
Translation: Most manly with these men of his who help him, dealing out wealth and gathering the treasure.

Sanskit Text: कियत सविद इन्द्रो अध्य एति मातुः कियत पितुर जनितुर यो जजान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kiyat svid indro adhy eti mātuḥ kiyat pitur janitur yo jajāna |
Translation: 12 What is the care of Indra for his Mother, what cares he for the Father who begat him?

Sanskit Text: यो अस्य शुष्मम मुहुकैर इयर्ति वातो न जूत सतनयद्भिर अभ्रैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo asya śuṣmam muhukair iyarti vāto na jūta stanayadbhir abhraiḥ ||
Translation: His care is that which speeds his might in conflicts, like wind borne onward by the clouds that thunder.

Sanskit Text: कषियन्तं तवम अक्षियन्तं कर्णोतीयर्ति रेणुम मघवा समोहम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣiyantaṃ tvam akṣiyantaṃ kṛṇotīyarti reṇum maghavā samoham |
Translation: 13 Maghavan makes the settled man unsettled: he scatters dust that he hath swept together,

Sanskit Text: विभञ्जनुर अशनिमां इव दयौर उत सतोतारम मघवा वसौ धात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vibhañjanur aśanimāṃ iva dyaur uta stotāram maghavā vasau dhāt ||
Translation: Breaking in pieces like Heaven armed with lightning: Maghavan shall enrich the man who lauds h;m.

Sanskit Text: अयं चक्रम इषणत सूर्यस्य नय एतशं रीरमत सस्र्माणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ cakram iṣaṇat sūryasya ny etaśaṃ rīramat sasṛmāṇam |
Translation: 14 He urged the chariot-wheel of Sūrya forward: Etaśa, speeding on his way, he rested.

Sanskit Text: आ कर्ष्ण ईं जुहुराणो जिघर्ति तवचो बुध्ने रजसो अस्य योनौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā kṛṣṇa īṃ juhurāṇo jigharti tvaco budhne rajaso asya yonau ||
Translation: Him the black undulating cloud bedeweth, in this mid-air's depth, at the base of darkness,

Sanskit Text: असिक्न्यां यजमानो न होता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asiknyāṃ yajamāno na hotā ||
Translation: 15 As in the night the sacrificing priest.

Sanskit Text: गव्यन्त इन्द्रं सख्याय विप्रा अश्वायन्तो वर्षणं वाजयन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghavyanta indraṃ sakhyāya viprā aśvāyanto vṛṣaṇaṃ vājayantaḥ |
Translation: 16 Eager for booty, craving strength and horses, we-singers stir Indra, the strong, for friendship,

Sanskit Text: जनीयन्तो जनिदाम अक्षितोतिम आ चयावयामो ऽवते न कोशम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: janīyanto janidām akṣitotim ā cyāvayāmo 'vate na kośam ||
Translation: Who gives the wives we seek, whose succour fails not, to hasten, like a pitcher to the fountain.

Sanskit Text: तराता नो बोधि दद्र्शान आपिर अभिख्याता मर्डिता सोम्यानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trātā no bodhi dadṛśāna āpir abhikhyātā marḍitā somyānām |
Translation: 17 Be thou our guardian, show thyself our kinsman, watching and blessing those who pour the Soma;

Sanskit Text: सखा पिता पित्र्तमः पित्णां कर्तेम उलोकम उशते वयोधाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhā pitā pitṛtamaḥ pitṇāṃ kartem ulokam uśate vayodhāḥ ||
Translation: As Friend, as Sire, most fatherly of fathers giving the suppliant vital strength and freedom.

Sanskit Text: सखीयताम अविता बोधि सखा गर्णान इन्द्र सतुवते वयो धाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhīyatām avitā bodhi sakhā ghṛṇāna indra stuvate vayo dhāḥ |
Translation: 18 Be helping Friend of those who seek thy friendship . give life, when lauded, Indra, to the singer.

Sanskit Text: वयं हय आ ते चक्र्मा सबाध आभिः शमीभिर महयन्त इन्द्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ hy ā te cakṛmā sabādha ābhiḥ śamībhir mahayanta indra ||
Translation: For, Indra, we the priests have paid thee worship, exalting thee with these our sacrifices.

Sanskit Text: सतुत इन्द्रो मघवा यद ध वर्त्रा भूरीण्य एको अप्रतीनि हन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stuta indro maghavā yad dha vṛtrā bhūrīṇy eko apratīni hanti |
Translation: 19 Alone, when Indra Maghavan is lauded, he slayeth many ne’er-resisted Vṛtras.

Sanskit Text: अस्य परियो जरिता यस्य शर्मन नकिर देवा वारयन्ते न मर्ताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya priyo jaritā yasya śarman nakir devā vārayante na martāḥ ||
Translation: Him in whose keeping is the well-loved singer never do Gods or mortals stay or hinder.

Sanskit Text: एवा न इन्द्रो मघवा विरप्शी करत सत्या चर्षणीध्र्द अनर्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā na indro maghavā virapśī karat satyā carṣaṇīdhṛd anarvā |
Translation: 20 E’en so let Maghavan, the loud-voiced Indra, give us true blessings, foeless, men's upholder.

Sanskit Text: तवं राजा जनुषां धेह्य अस्मे अधि शरवो माहिनं यज जरित्रे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ rājā januṣāṃ dhehy asme adhi śravo māhinaṃ yaj jaritre ||
Translation: King of all creatures, give us glory amply, exalted glory due to him who lauds thee.

Sanskit Text: नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū ṣṭuta indra nū ghṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ |
Translation: 21 Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high like rivers for the singer.

Sanskit Text: अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ ||
Translation: For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

Sanskit Text: अयम पन्था अनुवित्तः पुराणो यतो देवा उदजायन्त विश्वे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayam panthā anuvittaḥ purāṇo yato devā udajāyanta viśve |
Translation: 1. THIS is the ancient and accepted pathway by which all Gods have come into existence.

Sanskit Text: अतश चिद आ जनिषीष्ट परव्र्द्धो मा मातरम अमुया पत्तवे कः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ataś cid ā janiṣīṣṭa pravṛddho mā mātaram amuyā pattave kaḥ ||
Translation: Hereby could one be born though waxen mighty. Let him not, otherwise, destroy his Mother.

Sanskit Text: नाहम अतो निर अया दुर्गहैतत तिरश्चता पार्श्वान निर गमाणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāham ato nir ayā durghahaitat tiraścatā pārśvān nir ghamāṇi |
Translation: 2 Not this way go I forth: hard is the passage. Forth from the side obliquely will I issue.

Sanskit Text: बहूनि मे अक्र्ता कर्त्वानि युध्यै तवेन सं तवेन पर्छै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bahūni me akṛtā kartvāni yudhyai tvena saṃ tvena pṛchai ||
Translation: Much that is yet undone must I accomplish; one must I combat and the other question.

Sanskit Text: परायतीम मातरम अन्व अचष्ट न नानु गान्य अनु नू गमानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parāyatīm mātaram anv acaṣṭa na nānu ghāny anu nū ghamāni |
Translation: 3 He bent his eye upon the dying Mother: My word I now withdraw. That way I follow.

Sanskit Text: तवष्टुर गर्हे अपिबत सोमम इन्द्रः शतधन्यं चम्वोः सुतस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṣṭur ghṛhe apibat somam indraḥ śatadhanyaṃ camvoḥ sutasya ||
Translation: In Tvaṣṭar's dwelling India drank the Soma, a hundredworth of juice pressed from the mortar.

Sanskit Text: किं स रधक कर्णवद यं सहस्रम मासो जभार शरदश च पूर्वीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kiṃ sa ṛdhak kṛṇavad yaṃ sahasram māso jabhāra śaradaś ca pūrvīḥ |
Translation: 4 What strange act shall he do, he whom his Mother bore for a thousand months and many autumns?

Sanskit Text: नही नव अस्य परतिमानम अस्त्य अन्तर जातेषूत ये जनित्वाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahī nv asya pratimānam asty antar jāteṣūta ye janitvāḥ ||
Translation: No peer hath he among those born already, nor among those who shall be born hereafter.

Sanskit Text: अवद्यम इव मन्यमाना गुहाकर इन्द्रम माता वीर्येणा नयॄष्टम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avadyam iva manyamānā ghuhākar indram mātā vīryeṇā nyṝṣṭam |
Translation: 5 Deeming him a reproach, his mother hid him, Indra, endowed with all heroic valour.

Sanskit Text: अथोद अस्थात सवयम अत्कं वसान आ रोदसी अप्र्णाज जायमानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athod asthāt svayam atkaṃ vasāna ā rodasī apṛṇāj jāyamānaḥ ||
Translation: Then up he sprang himself, assumed his vesture, and filled, as soon as born, the earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: एता अर्षन्त्य अललाभवन्तीर रतावरीर इव संक्रोशमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etā arṣanty alalābhavantīr ṛtāvarīr iva saṃkrośamānāḥ |
Translation: 6 With lively motion onward flow these waters, the Holy Ones, shouting, as ’twere, together.

Sanskit Text: एता वि पर्छ किम इदम भनन्ति कम आपो अद्रिम परिधिं रुजन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: etā vi pṛcha kim idam bhananti kam āpo adrim paridhiṃ rujanti ||
Translation: Ask them to. tell thee what the floods are saying, what girdling rock the waters burst asunder.

Sanskit Text: किम उ षविद अस्मै निविदो भनन्तेन्द्रस्यावद्यं दिधिषन्त आपः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kim u ṣvid asmai nivido bhanantendrasyāvadyaṃ didhiṣanta āpaḥ |
Translation: 7 Are they addressing him with words of welcome? Will the floods take on them the shame of Indra?

Sanskit Text: ममैतान पुत्रो महता वधेन वर्त्रं जघन्वां अस्र्जद वि सिन्धून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mamaitān putro mahatā vadhena vṛtraṃ jaghanvāṃ asṛjad vi sindhūn ||
Translation: With his great thunderbolt my Son hath slaughtered Vṛtra, and set these rivers free to wander.

Sanskit Text: ममच चन तवा युवतिः परास ममच चन तवा कुषवा जगार |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mamac cana tvā yuvatiḥ parāsa mamac cana tvā kuṣavā jaghāra |
Translation: 8 I cast thee from me, mine,—thy youthful mother: thee, mine own offspring, Kusava hath swallowed.

Sanskit Text: ममच चिद आपः शिशवे मम्र्ड्युर ममच चिद इन्द्रः सहसोद अतिष्ठत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mamac cid āpaḥ śiśave mamṛḍyur mamac cid indraḥ sahasod atiṣṭhat ||
Translation: To him, mine infant, were the waters gracious. Indra, my Son, rose up in conquering vigour.

Sanskit Text: ममच चन ते मघवन वयंसो निविविध्वां अप हनू जघान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mamac cana te maghavan vyaṃso nivividhvāṃ apa hanū jaghāna |
Translation: 9 Thou art mine own, O Maghavan, whom Vyaṁsa struck to the ground and smote thy jaws in pieces.

Sanskit Text: अधा निविद्ध उत्तरो बभूवाञ छिरो दासस्य सम पिणक वधेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā nividdha uttaro babhūvāñ chiro dāsasya sam piṇak vadhena ||
Translation: But, smitten through, the mastery thou wonnest, and with thy bolt the Dāsa's head thou crushedst.

Sanskit Text: गर्ष्टिः ससूव सथविरं तवागाम अनाध्र्ष्यं वर्षभं तुम्रम इन्द्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛṣṭiḥ sasūva sthaviraṃ tavāghām anādhṛṣyaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ tumram indram |
Translation: 10 The Heifer hath brought forth the Strong, the Mighty, the unconquerable Bull, the furious Indra.

Sanskit Text: अरीळ्हं वत्सं चरथाय माता सवयं गातुं तन्व इछमानम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arīḷhaṃ vatsaṃ carathāya mātā svayaṃ ghātuṃ tanva ichamānam ||
Translation: The Mother left her unlicked Calf to wander, seeking himself, the path that he would follow.

Sanskit Text: उत माता महिषम अन्व अवेनद अमी तवा जहति पुत्र देवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta mātā mahiṣam anv avenad amī tvā jahati putra devāḥ |
Translation: 11 Then to her mighty Child the Mother turned her, saying, My son, these Deities forsake thee.

Sanskit Text: अथाब्रवीद वर्त्रम इन्द्रो हनिष्यन सखे विष्णो वितरं वि करमस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athābravīd vṛtram indro haniṣyan sakhe viṣṇo vitaraṃ vi kramasva ||
Translation: Then Indra said, about to slaughter Vṛtra, O my friend Vṛtra, stride full boldly forward.

Sanskit Text: कस ते मातरं विधवाम अचक्रच छयुं कस तवाम अजिघांसच चरन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kas te mātaraṃ vidhavām acakrac chayuṃ kas tvām ajighāṃsac carantam |
Translation: 12 Who was he then who made thy Mother widow? Who sought to stay thee lying still or moving?

Sanskit Text: कस ते देवो अधि मार्डीक आसीद यत पराक्षिणाः पितरम पादग्र्ह्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kas te devo adhi mārḍīka āsīd yat prākṣiṇāḥ pitaram pādaghṛhya ||
Translation: What God, when by the foot thy Sire thou tookest and slewest, was at hand to give thee comfort?

Sanskit Text: अवर्त्या शुन आन्त्राणि पेचे न देवेषु विविदे मर्डितारम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avartyā śuna āntrāṇi pece na deveṣu vivide marḍitāram |
Translation: 13 In deep distress I cooked a dog's intestines. Among the Gods I found not one to comfort.

Sanskit Text: अपश्यं जायाम अमहीयमानाम अधा मे शयेनो मध्व आ जभार ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apaśyaṃ jāyām amahīyamānām adhā me śyeno madhv ā jabhāra ||
Translation: My consort I beheld in degradation. The Falcon then brought me the pleasant Soma.

Sanskit Text: एवा तवाम इन्द्र वज्रिन्न अत्र विश्वे देवासः सुहवास ऊमाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā tvām indra vajrinn atra viśve devāsaḥ suhavāsa ūmāḥ |
Translation: 1. THEE, verily, O Thunder-wielding Indra, all the Gods here, the Helpers swift to listen,

Sanskit Text: महाम उभे रोदसी वर्द्धम रष्वं निर एकम इद वर्णते वर्त्रहत्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahām ubhe rodasī vṛddham ṛṣvaṃ nir ekam id vṛṇate vṛtrahatye ||
Translation: And both the worlds elected, thee the Mighty, High, waxen strong, alone to slaughter Vṛtra.

Sanskit Text: अवास्र्जन्त जिव्रयो न देवा भुवः सम्राळ इन्द्र सत्ययोनिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avāsṛjanta jivrayo na devā bhuvaḥ samrāḷ indra satyayoniḥ |
Translation: 2 The Gods, as worn witheld, relaxed their efforts: thou, Indra, born of truth, wast Sovran Ruler.

Sanskit Text: अहन्न अहिम परिशयानम अर्णः पर वर्तनीर अरदो विश्वधेनाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahann ahim pariśayānam arṇaḥ pra vartanīr arado viśvadhenāḥ ||
Translation: Thou slewest Ahi who besieged the waters, and duggest out their all-supporting channels.

Sanskit Text: अत्र्प्णुवन्तं वियतम अबुध्यम अबुध्यमानं सुषुपाणम इन्द्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atṛpṇuvantaṃ viyatam abudhyam abudhyamānaṃ suṣupāṇam indra |
Translation: 3 The insatiate one, extended, hard to waken, who slumbered in perpetual sleep, O Indra,—

Sanskit Text: सप्त परति परवत आशयानम अहिं वज्रेण वि रिणा अपर्वन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sapta prati pravata āśayānam ahiṃ vajreṇa vi riṇā aparvan ||
Translation: The Dragon stretched against the seven prone rivers, where no joint was, thou rentest with thy thunder.

Sanskit Text: अक्षोदयच छवसा कषाम बुध्नं वार ण वातस तविषीभिर इन्द्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: akṣodayac chavasā kṣāma budhnaṃ vār ṇa vātas taviṣībhir indraḥ |
Translation: 4 Indra with might shook earth and her foundation as the wind stirs the water with its fury.

Sanskit Text: दर्ळ्हान्य औभ्नाद उशमान ओजो ऽवाभिनत ककुभः पर्वतानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dṛḷhāny aubhnād uśamāna ojo 'vābhinat kakubhaḥ parvatānām ||
Translation: Striving, with strength he burst the firm asunder, and tore away the summits of the mountains.

Sanskit Text: अभि पर दद्रुर जनयो न गर्भं रथा इव पर ययुः साकम अद्रयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi pra dadrur janayo na gharbhaṃ rathā iva pra yayuḥ sākam adrayaḥ |
Translation: 5 They ran to thee as mothers to their offspring: the clouds, like chariots, hastened forth together.

Sanskit Text: अतर्पयो विस्र्त उब्ज ऊर्मीन तवं वर्तां अरिणा इन्द्र सिन्धून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atarpayo visṛta ubja ūrmīn tvaṃ vṛtāṃ ariṇā indra sindhūn ||
Translation: Thou didst refresh the streams and force the billows: thou, Indra, settest free obstructed rivers.

Sanskit Text: तवम महीम अवनिं विश्वधेनां तुर्वीतये वय्याय कषरन्तीम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvam mahīm avaniṃ viśvadhenāṃ turvītaye vayyāya kṣarantīm |
Translation: 6 Thou for the sake of Vayya and Turvīti didst stay the great stream, flowing, all-sustaining:

Sanskit Text: अरमयो नमसैजद अर्णः सुतरणां अक्र्णोर इन्द्र सिन्धून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aramayo namasaijad arṇaḥ sutaraṇāṃ akṛṇor indra sindhūn ||
Translation: Yea, at their prayer didst check the rushing river and make the floods easy to cross, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: पराग्रुवो नभन्वो न वक्वा धवस्रा अपिन्वद युवतीर रतज्ञाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāghruvo nabhanvo na vakvā dhvasrā apinvad yuvatīr ṛtajñāḥ |
Translation: 7 He let the young Maids skilled in Law, unwedded, like fountains, bubbling, flow forth streaming onward.

Sanskit Text: धन्वान्य अज्रां अप्र्णक तर्षाणां अधोग इन्द्र सतर्यो दंसुपत्नीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhanvāny ajrāṃ apṛṇak tṛṣāṇāṃ adhogh indra staryo daṃsupatnīḥ ||
Translation: He inundated thirsty plains and deserts, and milked the dry Cows of the mighty master.

Sanskit Text: पूर्वीर उषसः शरदश च गूर्ता वर्त्रं जघन्वां अस्र्जद वि सिन्धून |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvīr uṣasaḥ śaradaś ca ghūrtā vṛtraṃ jaghanvāṃ asṛjad vi sindhūn |
Translation: 8 Through many a morn and many a lovely autumn, having slain Vṛtra, he set free the rivers.

Sanskit Text: परिष्ठिता अत्र्णद बद्बधानाः सीरा इन्द्रः सरवितवे पर्थिव्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pariṣṭhitā atṛṇad badbadhānāḥ sīrā indraḥ sravitave pṛthivyā ||
Translation: Indra hath set at liberty to wander on earth the streams encompassed pressed together.

Sanskit Text: वम्रीभिः पुत्रम अग्रुवो अदानं निवेशनाद धरिव आ जभर्थ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vamrībhiḥ putram aghruvo adānaṃ niveśanād dhariva ā jabhartha |
Translation: 9 Lord of Bay Steeds, thou broughtest from the ant-hill the unwedded damsel's son whom ants were eating.

Sanskit Text: वय अन्धो अख्यद अहिम आददानो निर भूद उखछित सम अरन्त पर्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vy andho akhyad ahim ādadāno nir bhūd ukhachit sam aranta parva ||
Translation: The blind saw clearly, as he grasped the serpent, rose, brake the jar: his joints again united.

Sanskit Text: पर ते पूर्वाणि करणानि विप्राविद्वां आह विदुषे करांसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te pūrvāṇi karaṇāni viprāvidvāṃ āha viduṣe karāṃsi |
Translation: 10 To the wise man, O Sage and Sovran Ruler, the man who knoweth all thine ancient exploits.

Sanskit Text: यथा-यथा वर्ष्ण्यानि सवगूर्तापांसि राजन नर्याविवेषीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā-yathā vṛṣṇyāni svaghūrtāpāṃsi rājan naryāviveṣīḥ ||
Translation: Hath told these deeds of might as thou hast wrought them, great acts, spontaneous, and to man's advantage.

Sanskit Text: नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū ṣṭuta indra nū ghṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ |
Translation: 11 Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let powers swell high, like rivers, for the singer.

Sanskit Text: अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ ||
Translation: For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

Sanskit Text: आ न इन्द्रो दूराद आ न आसाद अभिष्टिक्र्द अवसे यासद उग्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā na indro dūrād ā na āsād abhiṣṭikṛd avase yāsad ughraḥ |
Translation: 1. FROM near or far away may mighty Indra giver of succour, come for our protection

Sanskit Text: ओजिष्ठेभिर नर्पतिर वज्रबाहुः संगे समत्सु तुर्वणिः पर्तन्यून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ojiṣṭhebhir nṛpatir vajrabāhuḥ saṃghe samatsu turvaṇiḥ pṛtanyūn ||
Translation: Lord of men, armed with thunder, with the Strongest, slaying his foes in conflict, in the battles.

Sanskit Text: आ न इन्द्रो हरिभिर यात्व अछार्वाचीनो ऽवसे राधसे च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā na indro haribhir yātv achārvācīno 'vase rādhase ca |
Translation: 2 May Indra come to us with Tawny Coursers, inclined to us, to favour and enrich us.

Sanskit Text: तिष्ठाति वज्री मघवा विरप्शीमं यज्ञम अनु नो वाजसातौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tiṣṭhāti vajrī maghavā virapśīmaṃ yajñam anu no vājasātau ||
Translation: May Maghavan, loud-voiced and wielding thunder, stand by us at this sacrifice, in combat.

Sanskit Text: इमं यज्ञं तवम अस्माकम इन्द्र पुरो दधत सनिष्यसि करतुं नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ yajñaṃ tvam asmākam indra puro dadhat saniṣyasi kratuṃ naḥ |
Translation: 3 Thou, honouring this our sacrifice, O Indra, shalt give us strength and fill us full of courage.

Sanskit Text: शवघ्नीव वज्रिन सनये धनानां तवया वयम अर्य आजिं जयेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śvaghnīva vajrin sanaye dhanānāṃ tvayā vayam arya ājiṃ jayema ||
Translation: To win the booty, Thunder-armed! like hunters may we with thee subdue in fight our foemen.

Sanskit Text: उशन्न उ षु णः सुमना उपाके सोमस्य नु सुषुतस्य सवधावः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uśann u ṣu ṇaḥ sumanā upāke somasya nu suṣutasya svadhāvaḥ |
Translation: 4 Loving us well, benevolent, close beside us, drink, Godlike Indra, of the well-pressed Soma.

Sanskit Text: पा इन्द्र परतिभ्र्तस्य मध्वः सम अन्धसा ममदः पर्ष्ठ्येन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pā indra pratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ sam andhasā mamadaḥ pṛṣṭhyena ||
Translation: Drink of the meath we offer, and delight thee with food that cometh from the mountain ridges.

Sanskit Text: वि यो ररप्श रषिभिर नवेभिर वर्क्षो न पक्वः सर्ण्यो न जेता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yo rarapśa ṛṣibhir navebhir vṛkṣo na pakvaḥ sṛṇyo na jetā |
Translation: 5 Him who is sung aloud by recent sages, like a ripe-fruited tree, a scythe-armed victor,—

Sanskit Text: मर्यो न योषाम अभि मन्यमानो ऽछा विवक्मि पुरुहूतम इन्द्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maryo na yoṣām abhi manyamāno 'chā vivakmi puruhūtam indram ||
Translation: I, like a bridegroom thinking of his consort, call hither Indra, him invoked of many;

Sanskit Text: गिरिर न यः सवतवां रष्व इन्द्रः सनाद एव सहसे जात उग्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghirir na yaḥ svatavāṃ ṛṣva indraḥ sanād eva sahase jāta ughraḥ |
Translation: 6 Him who in native strength is like a mountain, the lofty Indra born or old for conquest,

Sanskit Text: आदर्ता वज्रं सथविरं न भीम उद्नेव कोशं वसुना नयॄष्टम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādartā vajraṃ sthaviraṃ na bhīma udneva kośaṃ vasunā nyṝṣṭam ||
Translation: Terrific wielder of the ancient thunder. filled full with splendour as a jar with water.

Sanskit Text: न यस्य वर्ता जनुषा नव अस्ति न राधस आमरीता मघस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yasya vartā januṣā nv asti na rādhasa āmarītā maghasya |
Translation: 7 Whom from of old there is not one to hinder, none to curtail the riches of his bounty.

Sanskit Text: उद्वाव्र्षाणस तविषीव उग्रास्मभ्यं दद्धि पुरुहूत रायः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: udvāvṛṣāṇas taviṣīva ughrāsmabhyaṃ daddhi puruhūta rāyaḥ ||
Translation: Pouring forth freely, O thou Strong and Mighty, vouchsafe us riches, God invoked of many!

Sanskit Text: ईक्षे रायः कषयस्य चर्षणीनाम उत वरजम अपवर्तासि गोनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īkṣe rāyaḥ kṣayasya carṣaṇīnām uta vrajam apavartāsi ghonām |
Translation: 8 Of wealth and homes of men thou art the ruler, and opener of the stable of the cattle.

Sanskit Text: शिक्षानरः समिथेषु परहावान वस्वो राशिम अभिनेतासि भूरिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śikṣānaraḥ samitheṣu prahāvān vasvo rāśim abhinetāsi bhūrim ||
Translation: Helper of men, winner of spoil in combats, thou leadest to an ample heap of riches.

Sanskit Text: कया तच छर्ण्वे शच्या शचिष्ठो यया कर्णोति मुहु का चिद रष्वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kayā tac chṛṇve śacyā śaciṣṭho yayā kṛṇoti muhu kā cid ṛṣvaḥ |
Translation: 9 By what great might is he renowned as strongest, wherewith the Lofty One stirs up wild battles?

Sanskit Text: पुरु दाशुषे विचयिष्ठो अंहो ऽथा दधाति दरविणं जरित्रे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: puru dāśuṣe vicayiṣṭho aṃho 'thā dadhāti draviṇaṃ jaritre ||
Translation: Best soother of the worshipper's great sorrow, he gives possessions to the man who lauds him.

Sanskit Text: मा नो मर्धीर आ भरा दद्धि तन नः पर दाशुषे दातवे भूरि यत ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no mardhīr ā bharā daddhi tan naḥ pra dāśuṣe dātave bhūri yat te |
Translation: 10 Slay us not; bring, bestow onus the ample gift which thou hast to give to him who offers.

Sanskit Text: नव्ये देष्णे शस्ते अस्मिन त उक्थे पर बरवाम वयम इन्द्र सतुवन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: navye deṣṇe śaste asmin ta ukthe pra bravāma vayam indra stuvantaḥ ||
Translation: At this new gift, with this laud sung before thee, extolling thee, we, Indra, will declare it.

Sanskit Text: नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū ṣṭuta indra nū ghṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ |
Translation: 11 Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high, like rivers, for the singer.

Sanskit Text: अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ ||
Translation: A new hymn, Lord of Bays! for thee is fashioned. May we, car-born, through song be victors ever.

Sanskit Text: आ यात्व इन्द्रो ऽवस उप न इह सतुतः सधमाद अस्तु शूरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yātv indro 'vasa upa na iha stutaḥ sadhamād astu śūraḥ |
Translation: 1. MAY Indra come to us for our protection; here be the Hero, praised, our feast-companion.

Sanskit Text: वाव्र्धानस तविषीर यस्य पूर्वीर दयौर न कषत्रम अभिभूति पुष्यात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāvṛdhānas taviṣīr yasya pūrvīr dyaur na kṣatram abhibhūti puṣyāt ||
Translation: May he whose powers are many, waxen mighty, cherish, like Dyaus, his own supreme dominion.

Sanskit Text: तस्येद इह सतवथ वर्ष्ण्यानि तुविद्युम्नस्य तुविराधसो नॄन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasyed iha stavatha vṛṣṇyāni tuvidyumnasya tuvirādhaso nṝn |
Translation: 2 Here magnify his great heroic exploits, most glorious One, enriching men with bounties,

Sanskit Text: यस्य करतुर विदथ्यो न सम्राट साह्वान तरुत्रो अभ्य अस्ति कर्ष्टीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya kratur vidathyo na samrāṭ sāhvān tarutro abhy asti kṛṣṭīḥ ||
Translation: Whose will is like a Sovran in assembly, who rules the people, Conqueror, all-surpassing.

Sanskit Text: आ यात्व इन्द्रो दिव आ पर्थिव्या मक्षू समुद्राद उत वा पुरीषात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yātv indro diva ā pṛthivyā makṣū samudrād uta vā purīṣāt |
Translation: 3 Hither let Indra come from earth or heaven, hither with speech from firmament or ocean;

Sanskit Text: सवर्णराद अवसे नो मरुत्वान परावतो वा सदनाद रतस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svarṇarād avase no marutvān parāvato vā sadanād ṛtasya ||
Translation: With Maruts, from the realm of light to aid us, or from a distance, from the seat of Order.

Sanskit Text: सथूरस्य रायो बर्हतो य ईशे तम उ षटवाम विदथेष्व इन्द्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sthūrasya rāyo bṛhato ya īśe tam u ṣṭavāma vidatheṣv indram |
Translation: 4 That Indra will we laud in our assemblies, him who is Lord of great and lasting riches,

Sanskit Text: यो वायुना जयति गोमतीषु पर धर्ष्णुया नयति वस्यो अछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vāyunā jayati ghomatīṣu pra dhṛṣṇuyā nayati vasyo acha ||
Translation: Victor with Vāyu where the herds are gathered, who leads with boldness on to higher fortune.

Sanskit Text: उप यो नमो नमसि सतभायन्न इयर्ति वाचं जनयन यजध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa yo namo namasi stabhāyann iyarti vācaṃ janayan yajadhyai |
Translation: 5 May the Priest, Lord of many blessings, striving,—who fixing reverence on reverence, giving

Sanskit Text: रञ्जसानः पुरुवार उक्थैर एन्द्रं कर्ण्वीत सदनेषु होता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛñjasānaḥ puruvāra ukthair endraṃ kṛṇvīta sadaneṣu hotā ||
Translation: Vent to his voice, inciteth men to worship—with lauds bring Indra hither to our dwellings.

Sanskit Text: धिषा यदि धिषण्यन्तः सरण्यान सदन्तो अद्रिम औशिजस्य गोहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiṣā yadi dhiṣaṇyantaḥ saraṇyān sadanto adrim auśijasya ghohe |
Translation: 6 When sitting pondering in deep devotion in Auśija's abode they ply the press-stone,

Sanskit Text: आ दुरोषाः पास्त्यस्य होता यो नो महान संवरणेषु वह्निः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā duroṣāḥ pāstyasya hotā yo no mahān saṃvaraṇeṣu vahniḥ ||
Translation: May he whose wrath is fierce, the mighty bearer, come as the house-lord's priest within our chambers.

Sanskit Text: सत्रा यद ईम भार्वरस्य वर्ष्णः सिषक्ति शुष्म सतुवते भराय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satrā yad īm bhārvarasya vṛṣṇaḥ siṣakti śuṣma stuvate bharāya |
Translation: 7 Surely the power of Bhārvara the mighty for ever helpeth to support the singer;

Sanskit Text: गुहा यद ईम औशिजस्य गोहे पर यद धिये परायसे मदाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghuhā yad īm auśijasya ghohe pra yad dhiye prāyase madāya ||
Translation: That which in Auśija's abode lies hidden, to come forth for delight and for devotion.

Sanskit Text: वि यद वरांसि पर्वतस्य वर्ण्वे पयोभिर जिन्वे अपां जवांसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yad varāṃsi parvatasya vṛṇve payobhir jinve apāṃ javāṃsi |
Translation: 8 When he unbars the spaces of the mountains, and quickens with his floods the water-torrents,

Sanskit Text: विदद गौरस्य गवयस्य गोहे यदी वाजाय सुध्यो वहन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidad ghaurasya ghavayasya ghohe yadī vājāya sudhyo vahanti ||
Translation: He finds in lair the buffalo and wild-ox when the wise lead him on to vigorous exploit.

Sanskit Text: भद्रा ते हस्ता सुक्र्तोत पाणी परयन्तारा सतुवते राध इन्द्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadrā te hastā sukṛtota pāṇī prayantārā stuvate rādha indra |
Translation: 9 Auspicious are thy hands, thine arms well-fashioned which proffer bounty, Indra, to thy praiser.

Sanskit Text: का ते निषत्तिः किम उ नो ममत्सि किं नोद-उद उ हर्षसे दातवा उ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kā te niṣattiḥ kim u no mamatsi kiṃ nod-ud u harṣase dātavā u ||
Translation: What sloth is this? Why dost thou not rejoice thee? Why dost thou not delight thyself with giving?

Sanskit Text: एवा वस्व इन्द्रः सत्यः सम्राड ढन्ता वर्त्रं वरिवः पूरवे कः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā vasva indraḥ satyaḥ samrāḍ ḍhantā vṛtraṃ varivaḥ pūrave kaḥ |
Translation: 10 So Indra is the truthful Lord of treasure. Freedom he gave to man by slaying Vṛtra.

Sanskit Text: पुरुष्टुत करत्वा नः शग्धि रायो भक्षीय ते ऽवसो दैव्यस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: puruṣṭuta kratvā naḥ śaghdhi rāyo bhakṣīya te 'vaso daivyasya ||
Translation: Much-lauded! help us with thy power to riches: may I be sharer of thy Godlike favour.

Sanskit Text: नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū ṣṭuta indra nū ghṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ |
Translation: 11 Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high, like rivers, for the singer.

Sanskit Text: अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ ||
Translation: For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, care-borne, through song be victors ever.

Sanskit Text: यन न इन्द्रो जुजुषे यच च वष्टि तन नो महान करति शुष्म्य आ चित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yan na indro jujuṣe yac ca vaṣṭi tan no mahān karati śuṣmy ā cit |
Translation: 1. THAT gift of ours which Indra loves and welcomes, even that he makes for us, the Great and Strong One.

Sanskit Text: बरह्म सतोमम मघवा सोमम उक्था यो अश्मानं शवसा बिभ्रद एति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahma stomam maghavā somam ukthā yo aśmānaṃ śavasā bibhrad eti ||
Translation: He who comes wielding in his might the thunder, Maghavan, gives prayer, praise, and laud, and Soma.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा वर्षन्धिं चतुरश्रिम अस्यन्न उग्रो बाहुभ्यां नर्तमः शचीवान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā vṛṣandhiṃ caturaśrim asyann ughro bāhubhyāṃ nṛtamaḥ śacīvān |
Translation: 2 Bull, hurler of the four-edged rain-producer with both his arms, strong, mighty, most heroic;

Sanskit Text: शरिये परुष्णीम उषमाण ऊर्णां यस्याः पर्वाणि सख्याय विव्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śriye paruṣṇīm uṣamāṇa ūrṇāṃ yasyāḥ parvāṇi sakhyāya vivye ||
Translation: Wearing as wool Paruṣṇī for adornment, whose joints for sake of friendship he hath covered.

Sanskit Text: यो देवो देवतमो जायमानो महो वाजेभिर महद्भिश च शुष्मैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo devo devatamo jāyamāno maho vājebhir mahadbhiś ca śuṣmaiḥ |
Translation: 3 God who of all the Gods was born divinest, endowed with ample strength and mighty powers,

Sanskit Text: दधानो वज्रम बाह्वोर उशन्तं दयाम अमेन रेजयत पर भूम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhāno vajram bāhvor uśantaṃ dyām amena rejayat pra bhūma ||
Translation: And bearing in his arms the yearning thunder, with violent rush caused heaven and earth to tremble.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा रोधांसि परवतश च पूर्वीर दयौर रष्वाज जनिमन रेजत कषाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā rodhāṃsi pravataś ca pūrvīr dyaur ṛṣvāj janiman rejata kṣāḥ |
Translation: 4 Before the High God, at his birth, heaven trembled, earth, many floods and all the precipices.

Sanskit Text: आ मातरा भरति शुष्म्य आ गोर नर्वत परिज्मन नोनुवन्त वाताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā mātarā bharati śuṣmy ā ghor nṛvat parijman nonuvanta vātāḥ ||
Translation: The Strong One bringeth nigh the Bull's two Parents: loud sing the winds, like men, in air's mid-region.

Sanskit Text: ता तू त इन्द्र महतो महानि विश्वेष्व इत सवनेषु परवाच्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā tū ta indra mahato mahāni viśveṣv it savaneṣu pravācyā |
Translation: 5 These are thy great deeds, Indra, thine, the Mighty, deeds to be told aloud at all libations,

Sanskit Text: यच छूर धर्ष्णो धर्षता दध्र्ष्वान अहिं वज्रेण शवसाविवेषीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yac chūra dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā dadhṛṣvān ahiṃ vajreṇa śavasāviveṣīḥ ||
Translation: That thou, O Hero, bold and boldly daring, didst with thy bolt, by strength, destroy the Dragon.

Sanskit Text: ता तू ते सत्या तुविन्र्म्ण विश्वा पर धेनवः सिस्रते वर्ष्ण ऊध्नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā tū te satyā tuvinṛmṇa viśvā pra dhenavaḥ sisrate vṛṣṇa ūdhnaḥ |
Translation: 6 True are all these thy deeds, O Most Heroic. The Milch-kine issued from the streaming udder.

Sanskit Text: अधा ह तवद वर्षमणो भियानाः पर सिन्धवो जवसा चक्रमन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā ha tvad vṛṣamaṇo bhiyānāḥ pra sindhavo javasā cakramanta ||
Translation: In fear of thee, O thou of manly spirit, the rivers swiftly set themselves in motion.

Sanskit Text: अत्राह ते हरिवस ता उ देवीर अवोभिर इन्द्र सतवन्त सवसारः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrāha te harivas tā u devīr avobhir indra stavanta svasāraḥ |
Translation: 7 With joy, O Indra, Lord of Tawny Coursers, the Sisters then, these Goddesses, extolled thee,

Sanskit Text: यत सीम अनु पर मुचो बद्बधाना दीर्घाम अनु परसितिं सयन्दयध्यै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat sīm anu pra muco badbadhānā dīrghām anu prasitiṃ syandayadhyai ||
Translation: When thou didst give the prisoned ones their freedom to wander at their will in long succession.

Sanskit Text: पिपीळे अंशुर मद्यो न सिन्धुर आ तवा शमी शशमानस्य शक्तिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pipīḷe aṃśur madyo na sindhur ā tvā śamī śaśamānasya śaktiḥ |
Translation: 8 Pressed is the gladdening stalk as ’twere a river: so let the rite, the toiler's power, attract thee

Sanskit Text: अस्मद्र्यक छुशुचानस्य यम्या आशुर न रश्मिं तुव्योजसं गोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmadryak chuśucānasya yamyā āśur na raśmiṃ tuvyojasaṃ ghoḥ ||
Translation: To us-ward, of the Bright One, as the courser strains his. exceedingly strong leather bridle.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे वर्षिष्ठा कर्णुहि जयेष्ठा नर्म्णानि सत्रा सहुरे सहांसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme varṣiṣṭhā kṛṇuhi jyeṣṭhā nṛmṇāni satrā sahure sahāṃsi |
Translation: 9 Ever by us perform thy most heroic, thine highest, best victorious deeds, O Victor.

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं वर्त्रा सुहनानि रन्धि जहि वधर वनुषो मर्त्यस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ vṛtrā suhanāni randhi jahi vadhar vanuṣo martyasya ||
Translation: For us make Vṛtras easy to be conquered: destroy the weapon of our mortal foeman.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकम इत सु शर्णुहि तवम इन्द्रास्मभ्यं चित्रां उप माहि वाजान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākam it su śṛṇuhi tvam indrāsmabhyaṃ citrāṃ upa māhi vājān |
Translation: 10 Graciously listen to our prayer, O Indra, and strength of varied sort bestow thou on us.

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं विश्वा इषणः पुरंधीर अस्माकं सु मघवन बोधि गोदाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ viśvā iṣaṇaḥ puraṃdhīr asmākaṃ su maghavan bodhi ghodāḥ ||
Translation: Send to us all intelligence arid wisdom O Maghavan, be he who gives us cattle.

Sanskit Text: नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū ṣṭuta indra nū ghṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ |
Translation: 11 Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let wealth swell high like rivers to the singer.

Sanskit Text: अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ ||
Translation: For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

Sanskit Text: कथा महाम अव्र्धत कस्य होतुर यज्ञं जुषाणो अभि सोमम ऊधः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kathā mahām avṛdhat kasya hotur yajñaṃ juṣāṇo abhi somam ūdhaḥ |
Translation: 1. How, what priest's sacrifice hath he made mighty, rejoicing in the Soma and its fountain?

Sanskit Text: पिबन्न उशानो जुषमाणो अन्धो ववक्ष रष्वः शुचते धनाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibann uśāno juṣamāṇo andho vavakṣa ṛṣvaḥ śucate dhanāya ||
Translation: Delighting in juice, eagerly drinking, the Lofty One hath waxed for splendid riches.

Sanskit Text: को अस्य वीरः सधमादम आप सम आनंश सुमतिभिः को अस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko asya vīraḥ sadhamādam āpa sam ānaṃśa sumatibhiḥ ko asya |
Translation: 2 What hero hath been made his feast-companion? Who hath been partner in his loving-kindness?

Sanskit Text: कद अस्य चित्रं चिकिते कद ऊती वर्धे भुवच छशमानस्य यज्योः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kad asya citraṃ cikite kad ūtī vṛdhe bhuvac chaśamānasya yajyoḥ ||
Translation: What know we of his wondrous acts? How often comes he to aid and speed the pious toiler?

Sanskit Text: कथा शर्णोति हूयमानम इन्द्रः कथा शर्ण्वन्न अवसाम अस्य वेद |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kathā śṛṇoti hūyamānam indraḥ kathā śṛṇvann avasām asya veda |
Translation: 3 How heareth Indra offered invocation? How, hearing, marketh he the invoker's wishes?

Sanskit Text: का अस्य पूर्वीर उपमातयो ह कथैनम आहुः पपुरिं जरित्रे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kā asya pūrvīr upamātayo ha kathainam āhuḥ papuriṃ jaritre ||
Translation: What are his ancient acts of bounty? Wherefore call they him One who filleth full the singer?

Sanskit Text: कथा सबाधः शशमानो अस्य नशद अभि दरविणं दीध्यानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kathā sabādhaḥ śaśamāno asya naśad abhi draviṇaṃ dīdhyānaḥ |
Translation: 4 How doth the priest who laboureth, ever longing, win for himself the wealth which he possesseth?

Sanskit Text: देवो भुवन नवेदा म रतानां नमो जग्र्भ्वां अभि यज जुजोषत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devo bhuvan navedā ma ṛtānāṃ namo jaghṛbhvāṃ abhi yaj jujoṣat ||
Translation: May he, the God, mark well my truthful praises, having received the homage which he loveth.

Sanskit Text: कथा कद अस्या उषसो वयुष्टौ देवो मर्तस्य सख्यं जुजोष |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kathā kad asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau devo martasya sakhyaṃ jujoṣa |
Translation: 5 How, and what bond of friendship with a mortal hath the God chosen as this morn is breaking?

Sanskit Text: कथा कद अस्य सख्यं सखिभ्यो ये अस्मिन कामं सुयुजं ततस्रे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kathā kad asya sakhyaṃ sakhibhyo ye asmin kāmaṃ suyujaṃ tatasre ||
Translation: How, and what love hath he for those who love him, who have entwined in him their firm affection?

Sanskit Text: किम आद अमत्रं सख्यं सखिभ्यः कदा नु ते भरात्रम पर बरवाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kim ād amatraṃ sakhyaṃ sakhibhyaḥ kadā nu te bhrātram pra bravāma |
Translation: 6 Is then thy friendship with thy friends most mighty? Thy brotherhood with us,—when may we tell it?

Sanskit Text: शरिये सुद्र्शो वपुर अस्य सर्गाः सवर ण चित्रतमम इष आ गोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śriye sudṛśo vapur asya sarghāḥ svar ṇa citratamam iṣa ā ghoḥ ||
Translation: The streams of milk move, as most wondrous sunlight, the beauty of the Lovely One for glory.

Sanskit Text: दरुहं जिघांसन धवरसम अनिन्द्रां तेतिक्ते तिग्मा तुजसे अनीका |
Sanskrit Transliteration: druhaṃ jighāṃsan dhvarasam anindrāṃ tetikte tighmā tujase anīkā |
Translation: 7 About to stay the Indra-less destructive spirit he sharpens his keen arms to strike her.

Sanskit Text: रणा चिद यत्र रणया न उग्रो दूरे अज्ञाता उषसो बबाधे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṇā cid yatra ṛṇayā na ughro dūre ajñātā uṣaso babādhe ||
Translation: Whereby the Strong, although our debts’ exactor, drives in the distant mornings that we know not.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य हि शुरुधः सन्ति पूर्वीर रतस्य धीतिर वर्जिनानि हन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya hi śurudhaḥ santi pūrvīr ṛtasya dhītir vṛjināni hanti |
Translation: 8 Eternal Law hath varied food that strengthens; thought of eternal Law, removes transgressions.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य शलोको बधिरा ततर्द कर्णा बुधानः शुचमान आयोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya śloko badhirā tatarda karṇā budhānaḥ śucamāna āyoḥ ||
Translation: The praise-hymn of eternal Law, arousing, glowing, hath oped the deaf ears of the living.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य दर्ळ्हा धरुणानि सन्ति पुरूणि चन्द्रा वपुषे वपूंषि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya dṛḷhā dharuṇāni santi purūṇi candrā vapuṣe vapūṃṣi |
Translation: 9 Firm-seated are eternal Law's foundations in its fair form are many splendid beauties.

Sanskit Text: रतेन दीर्घम इषणन्त पर्क्ष रतेन गाव रतम आ विवेशुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtena dīrgham iṣaṇanta pṛkṣa ṛtena ghāva ṛtam ā viveśuḥ ||
Translation: By holy Law long lasting food they bring us; by holy Law have cows come to our worship.

Sanskit Text: रतं येमान रतम इद वनोत्य रतस्य शुष्मस तुरया उ गव्युः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtaṃ yemāna ṛtam id vanoty ṛtasya śuṣmas turayā u ghavyuḥ |
Translation: 10 Fixing eternal Law he, too, upholds it swift moves the might of Law and wins the booty.

Sanskit Text: रताय पर्थ्वी बहुले गभीरे रताय धेनू परमे दुहाते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtāya pṛthvī bahule ghabhīre ṛtāya dhenū parame duhāte ||
Translation: To Law belong the vast deep Earth and Heaven: Milch-kine supreme, to Law their milk they render.

Sanskit Text: नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū ṣṭuta indra nū ghṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ |
Translation: 11 Now, Indra! lauded,—glorified with praises, let power swell high like rivers to the singer.

Sanskit Text: अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ ||
Translation: For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

Sanskit Text: का सुष्टुतिः शवसः सूनुम इन्द्रम अर्वाचीनं राधस आ ववर्तत |
