Sanskrit Transliteration: kā suṣṭutiḥ śavasaḥ sūnum indram arvācīnaṃ rādhasa ā vavartat |
Translation: 1. WHAT worthy praise will bring before us Indra, the Son of Strength, that he may grant us riches;

Sanskit Text: ददिर हि वीरो गर्णते वसूनि स गोपतिर निष्षिधां नो जनासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadir hi vīro ghṛṇate vasūni sa ghopatir niṣṣidhāṃ no janāsaḥ ||
Translation: For he the Hero, gives the singer treasures: he is the Lord who sends us gifts, ye people.

Sanskit Text: स वर्त्रहत्ये हव्यः स ईड्यः स सुष्टुत इन्द्रः सत्यराधाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vṛtrahatye havyaḥ sa īḍyaḥ sa suṣṭuta indraḥ satyarādhāḥ |
Translation: 2 To be invoked and hymned in fight with Vṛtra, that well-praised Indra gives us real bounties.

Sanskit Text: स यामन्न आ मघवा मर्त्याय बरह्मण्यते सुष्वये वरिवो धात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa yāmann ā maghavā martyāya brahmaṇyate suṣvaye varivo dhāt ||
Translation: That Maghavan brings comfort in the foray to the religious man who pours libations.

Sanskit Text: तम इन नरो वि हवयन्ते समीके रिरिक्वांसस तन्वः कर्ण्वत तराम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tam in naro vi hvayante samīke ririkvāṃsas tanvaḥ kṛṇvata trām |
Translation: 3 Him, verily, the men invoke in combat; risking their lives they make him their protector,

Sanskit Text: मिथो यत तयागम उभयासो अग्मन नरस तोकस्य तनयस्य सातौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitho yat tyāgham ubhayāso aghman naras tokasya tanayasya sātau ||
Translation: When heroes, foe to foe, give up their bodies, fighting, each side, for children and their offspring.

Sanskit Text: करतूयन्ति कषितयो योग उग्राशुषाणासो मिथो अर्णसातौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratūyanti kṣitayo yogha ughrāśuṣāṇāso mitho arṇasātau |
Translation: 4 Strong God! the folk at need put forth their vigour, striving together in the whirl of battle.

Sanskit Text: सं यद विशो ऽवव्र्त्रन्त युध्मा आद इन नेम इन्द्रयन्ते अभीके ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yad viśo 'vavṛtranta yudhmā ād in nema indrayante abhīke ||
Translation: When warrior bands encounter one another some in the grapple quit themselves like Indra.

Sanskit Text: आद इद ध नेम इन्द्रियं यजन्त आद इत पक्तिः पुरोळाशं रिरिच्यात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ād id dha nema indriyaṃ yajanta ād it paktiḥ puroḷāśaṃ riricyāt |
Translation: 5 Hence many a one worships the might of Indra: hence let the brew succeed the meal-oblation.

Sanskit Text: आद इत सोमो वि पप्र्च्याद असुष्वीन आद इज जुजोष वर्षभं यजध्यै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ād it somo vi papṛcyād asuṣvīn ād ij jujoṣa vṛṣabhaṃ yajadhyai ||
Translation: Hence let the Soma banish those who pour not: even hence I joy to pay the Strong One worship.

Sanskit Text: कर्णोत्य अस्मै वरिवो य इत्थेन्द्राय सोमम उशते सुनोति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṇoty asmai varivo ya itthendrāya somam uśate sunoti |
Translation: 6 Indra gives comfort to the man who truly presses, for him who longs

Sanskit Text: <a href="errata.htm#15">
for
it, the Soma,
सध्रीचीनेन मनसाविवेनन तम इत सखायं कर्णुते समत्सु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadhrīcīnena manasāvivenan tam it sakhāyaṃ kṛṇute samatsu ||
Translation: Not disaffected, with devoted spirit this man he takes to be his friend in battles.

Sanskit Text: य इन्द्राय सुनवत सोमम अद्य पचात पक्तीर उत भर्ज्जाति धानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya indrāya sunavat somam adya pacāt paktīr uta bhṛjjāti dhānāḥ |
Translation: 7 He who this day for Indra presses Soma, prepares the brew and fries the grains of barley—

Sanskit Text: परति मनायोर उचथानि हर्यन तस्मिन दधद वर्षणं शुष्मम इन्द्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati manāyor ucathāni haryan tasmin dadhad vṛṣaṇaṃ śuṣmam indraḥ ||
Translation: Loving the hymns of that devoted servant, to him may Indra give heroic vigour.

Sanskit Text: यदा समर्यं वय अचेद रघावा दीर्घं यद आजिम अभ्य अख्यद अर्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā samaryaṃ vy aced ṛghāvā dīrghaṃ yad ājim abhy akhyad aryaḥ |
Translation: 8 When the impetuous chief hath sought the

Sanskit Text: <a href="errata.htm#16">
conflict
, and the lord looked upon the long-drawn battle,
अचिक्रदद वर्षणम पत्न्य अछा दुरोण आ निशितं सोमसुद्भिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: acikradad vṛṣaṇam patny achā duroṇa ā niśitaṃ somasudbhiḥ ||
Translation: The matron calls to the Strong God whom pressers of Soma have encouraged in the dwelling.

Sanskit Text: भूयसा वस्नम अचरत कनीयो ऽविक्रीतो अकानिषम पुनर यन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūyasā vasnam acarat kanīyo 'vikrīto akāniṣam punar yan |
Translation: 9 He bid a small price for a thing of value: I was content, returning, still unpurchased.

Sanskit Text: स भूयसा कनीयो नारिरेचीद दीना दक्षा वि दुहन्ति पर वाणम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa bhūyasā kanīyo nārirecīd dīnā dakṣā vi duhanti pra vāṇam ||
Translation: He heightened not his insufficient offer. Simple and clever, both milk out the udder.

Sanskit Text: क इमं दशभिर ममेन्द्रं करीणाति धेनुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ka imaṃ daśabhir mamendraṃ krīṇāti dhenubhiḥ |
Translation: 10 Who for ten milch-kine purchaseth from me this Indra who is mine?

Sanskit Text: यदा वर्त्राणि जङघनद अथैनम मे पुनर ददत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanad athainam me punar dadat ||
Translation: When he hath slain the Vṛtras let the buyer give him back to me.

Sanskit Text: नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū ṣṭuta indra nū ghṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ |
Translation: 11 Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let wealth swell high like rivers for the singer.

Sanskit Text: अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ ||
Translation: For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

Sanskit Text: को अद्य नर्यो देवकाम उशन्न इन्द्रस्य सख्यं जुजोष |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko adya naryo devakāma uśann indrasya sakhyaṃ jujoṣa |
Translation: 1. WHAT friend of man, God-loving, hath delighted, yearning therefor, this day in Indra's friendship?

Sanskit Text: को वा महे ऽवसे पार्याय समिद्धे अग्नौ सुतसोम ईट्टे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko vā mahe 'vase pāryāya samiddhe aghnau sutasoma īṭṭe ||
Translation: Who with enkindled flame and flowing Soma laudeth him for his great protecting favour?

Sanskit Text: को नानाम वचसा सोम्याय मनायुर वा भवति वस्त उस्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko nānāma vacasā somyāya manāyur vā bhavati vasta usrāḥ |
Translation: 2 Who hath with prayer bowed to the Soma-lover? What pious man endues the beams of morning?

Sanskit Text: क इन्द्रस्य युज्यं कः सखित्वं को भरात्रं वष्टि कवये क ऊती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ka indrasya yujyaṃ kaḥ sakhitvaṃ ko bhrātraṃ vaṣṭi kavaye ka ūtī ||
Translation: Who seeks bond, friendship, brotherhood with Indra? Who hath recourse unto the Sage for succour?

Sanskit Text: को देवानाम अवो अद्या वर्णीते क आदित्यां अदितिं जयोतिर ईट्टे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko devānām avo adyā vṛṇīte ka ādityāṃ aditiṃ jyotir īṭṭe |
Translation: 3 Who claims to-day the Deities' protection, asks Aditi for light, or the Ādityas?

Sanskit Text: कस्याश्विनाव इन्द्रो अग्निः सुतस्यांशोः पिबन्ति मनसाविवेनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kasyāśvināv indro aghniḥ sutasyāṃśoḥ pibanti manasāvivenam ||
Translation: Of whose pressed stalk of Soma drink the Aśvins, Indra, and Agni, well-inclined in spirit?

Sanskit Text: तस्मा अग्निर भारतः शर्म यंसज जयोक पश्यात सूर्यम उच्चरन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmā aghnir bhārataḥ śarma yaṃsaj jyok paśyāt sūryam uccarantam |
Translation: 4 To him shall Agni Bhārata give shelter: long shall he look upon the Sun up-rising,

Sanskit Text: य इन्द्राय सुनवामेत्य आह नरे नर्याय नर्तमाय नर्णाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya indrāya sunavāmety āha nare naryāya nṛtamāya nṛṇām ||
Translation: Who sayeth, Let us press the juice for Indra, man's Friend, the Hero manliest of heroes.

Sanskit Text: न तं जिनन्ति बहवो न दभ्रा उर्व अस्मा अदितिः शर्म यंसत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na taṃ jinanti bahavo na dabhrā urv asmā aditiḥ śarma yaṃsat |
Translation: 5 Him neither few men overcome, nor many to him shall Aditi give spacious shelter.

Sanskit Text: परियः सुक्र्त परिय इन्द्रे मनायुः परियः सुप्रावीः परियो अस्य सोमी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyaḥ sukṛt priya indre manāyuḥ priyaḥ suprāvīḥ priyo asya somī ||
Translation: Dear is the pious, the devout, to Indra dear is the zealous, dear the Soma-bringer.

Sanskit Text: सुप्राव्यः पराशुषाळ एष वीरः सुष्वेः पक्तिं कर्णुते केवलेन्द्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suprāvyaḥ prāśuṣāḷ eṣa vīraḥ suṣveḥ paktiṃ kṛṇute kevalendraḥ |
Translation: 6 This Hero curbs the mighty for the zealous: the presser's brew Indra possesses solely:

Sanskit Text: नासुष्वेर आपिर न सखा न जामिर दुष्प्राव्यो ऽवहन्तेद अवाचः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāsuṣver āpir na sakhā na jāmir duṣprāvyo 'vahanted avācaḥ ||
Translation: No brother, kin, or friend to him who pours not, destroyer of the dumb who would resist him.

Sanskit Text: न रेवता पणिना सख्यम इन्द्रो ऽसुन्वता सुतपाः सं गर्णीते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na revatā paṇinā sakhyam indro 'sunvatā sutapāḥ saṃ ghṛṇīte |
Translation: 7 Not with the wealthy churl who pours no Soma doth Indra, Soma-drinker, bind alliance.

Sanskit Text: आस्य वेदः खिदति हन्ति नग्नं वि सुष्वये पक्तये केवलो भूत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsya vedaḥ khidati hanti naghnaṃ vi suṣvaye paktaye kevalo bhūt ||
Translation: He draws away his wealth and slays him naked, own Friend to him who offers, for oblation.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रम परे ऽवरे मध्यमास इन्द्रं यान्तो ऽवसितास इन्द्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indram pare 'vare madhyamāsa indraṃ yānto 'vasitāsa indram |
Translation: 8 Highest and lowest, men who stand between diem, going, returning, dwelling in contentment,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं कषियन्त उत युध्यमाना इन्द्रं नरो वाजयन्तो हवन्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ kṣiyanta uta yudhyamānā indraṃ naro vājayanto havante ||
Translation: Those who show forth their strength when urged to battle-these are the men who call for aid on Indra.

Sanskit Text: अहम मनुर अभवं सूर्यश चाहं कक्षीवां रषिर अस्मि विप्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aham manur abhavaṃ sūryaś cāhaṃ kakṣīvāṃ ṛṣir asmi vipraḥ |
Translation: 1. I WAS aforetime Manu, I was Sūrya: I am the sage Kakṣīvān, holy singer.

Sanskit Text: अहं कुत्सम आर्जुनेयं नय ॠञ्जे ऽहं कविर उशना पश्यता मा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ kutsam ārjuneyaṃ ny ṝñje 'haṃ kavir uśanā paśyatā mā ||
Translation: Kutsa the son of Ārjuni I master. I am the sapient Uśanā behold me.

Sanskit Text: अहम भूमिम अददाम आर्यायाहं वर्ष्टिं दाशुषे मर्त्याय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aham bhūmim adadām āryāyāhaṃ vṛṣṭiṃ dāśuṣe martyāya |
Translation: 2 I have bestowed the earth upon the Ārya, and rain upon the man who brings oblation.

Sanskit Text: अहम अपो अनयं वावशाना मम देवासो अनु केतम आयन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aham apo anayaṃ vāvaśānā mama devāso anu ketam āyan ||
Translation: I guided forth the loudly-roaring waters, and the Gods moved according to my pleasure.

Sanskit Text: अहम पुरो मन्दसानो वय ऐरं नव साकं नवतीः शम्बरस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aham puro mandasāno vy airaṃ nava sākaṃ navatīḥ śambarasya |
Translation: 3 In the wild joy of Soma I demolished Śambara's forts, ninety-and-nine, together;

Sanskit Text: शततमं वेश्यं सर्वताता दिवोदासम अतिथिग्वं यद आवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śatatamaṃ veśyaṃ sarvatātā divodāsam atithighvaṃ yad āvam ||
Translation: And, utterly, the hundredth habitation, when helping Divodāsa Atithigva.

Sanskit Text: पर सु ष विभ्यो मरुतो विर अस्तु पर शयेनः शयेनेभ्य आशुपत्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra su ṣa vibhyo maruto vir astu pra śyenaḥ śyenebhya āśupatvā |
Translation: 4 Before all birds be ranked this Bird, O Maruts; supreme of falcons be this fleet-winged Falcon,

Sanskit Text: अचक्रया यत सवधया सुपर्णो हव्यम भरन मनवे देवजुष्टम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: acakrayā yat svadhayā suparṇo havyam bharan manave devajuṣṭam ||
Translation: Because, strong- pinioned, with no car to bear him, he brought to Manu the Godloved oblation.

Sanskit Text: भरद यदि विर अतो वेविजानः पथोरुणा मनोजवा असर्जि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharad yadi vir ato vevijānaḥ pathoruṇā manojavā asarji |
Translation: 5 When the Bird brought it, hence in rapid motion sent on the wide path fleet as thought he hurried.

Sanskit Text: तूयं ययौ मधुना सोम्येनोत शरवो विविदे शयेनो अत्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tūyaṃ yayau madhunā somyenota śravo vivide śyeno atra ||
Translation: Swift he returned with sweetness of the Soma, and hence the Falcon hath acquired his glory.

Sanskit Text: रजीपी शयेनो ददमानो अंशुम परावतः शकुनो मन्द्रम मदम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛjīpī śyeno dadamāno aṃśum parāvataḥ śakuno mandram madam |
Translation: 6 Bearing the stalk, the Falcon speeding onward, Bird bringing from afar the draught that gladdens,

Sanskit Text: सोमम भरद दाद्र्हाणो देवावान दिवो अमुष्माद उत्तराद आदाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somam bharad dādṛhāṇo devāvān divo amuṣmād uttarād ādāya ||
Translation: Friend of the Gods, brought, grasping fast, the Soma which be bad taken from yon loftiest heaven.

Sanskit Text: आदाय शयेनो अभरत सोमं सहस्रं सवां अयुतं च साकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādāya śyeno abharat somaṃ sahasraṃ savāṃ ayutaṃ ca sākam |
Translation: 7 The Falcon took and brought the Soma, bearing thousand libations with him, yea, ten thousand.

Sanskit Text: अत्रा पुरंधिर अजहाद अरातीर मदे सोमस्य मूरा अमूरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrā puraṃdhir ajahād arātīr made somasya mūrā amūraḥ ||
Translation: The Bold One left Malignities behind him, wise, in wild joy of Soma, left the foolish.

Sanskit Text: गर्भे नु सन्न अन्व एषाम अवेदम अहं देवानां जनिमानि विश्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: gharbhe nu sann anv eṣām avedam ahaṃ devānāṃ janimāni viśvā |
Translation: 1. I, As I lay within the womb, considered all generations of these Gods in order.

Sanskit Text: शतम मा पुर आयसीर अरक्षन्न अध शयेनो जवसा निर अदीयम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śatam mā pura āyasīr arakṣann adha śyeno javasā nir adīyam ||
Translation: A hundred iron fortresses confined me but forth I flew with rapid speed a Falcon.

Sanskit Text: न घा स माम अप जोषं जभाराभीम आस तवक्षसा वीर्येण |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na ghā sa mām apa joṣaṃ jabhārābhīm āsa tvakṣasā vīryeṇa |
Translation: 2 Not at his own free pleasure did he bear me: he conquered with his strength and manly courage.

Sanskit Text: ईर्मा पुरंधिर अजहाद अरातीर उत वातां अतरच छूशुवानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: īrmā puraṃdhir ajahād arātīr uta vātāṃ atarac chūśuvānaḥ ||
Translation: Straightway the Bold One left the fiends behind him and passed the winds as he grew yet more mighty.

Sanskit Text: अव यच छयेनो अस्वनीद अध दयोर वि यद यदि वात ऊहुः पुरंधिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava yac chyeno asvanīd adha dyor vi yad yadi vāta ūhuḥ puraṃdhim |
Translation: 3 When with loud cry from heaven down sped the Falcon, thence hasting like the wind he bore the Bold One.

Sanskit Text: सर्जद यद अस्मा अव ह कषिपज जयां कर्शानुर अस्ता मनसा भुरण्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sṛjad yad asmā ava ha kṣipaj jyāṃ kṛśānur astā manasā bhuraṇyan ||
Translation: Then, wildly raging in his mind, the archer Kṛśānu aimed and loosed the string to strike him.

Sanskit Text: रजिप्य ईम इन्द्रावतो न भुज्युं शयेनो जभार बर्हतो अधि षणोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛjipya īm indrāvato na bhujyuṃ śyeno jabhāra bṛhato adhi ṣṇoḥ |
Translation: 4 The Falcon bore him from heaven's lofty summit as the swift car of Indra's Friend bore Bhujyu.

Sanskit Text: अन्तः पतत पतत्र्य अस्य पर्णम अध यामनि परसितस्य तद वेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: antaḥ patat patatry asya parṇam adha yāmani prasitasya tad veḥ ||
Translation: Then downward hither fell a flying feather of the Bird hasting forward in his journey.

Sanskit Text: अध शवेतं कलशं गोभिर अक्तम आपिप्यानम मघवा शुक्रम अन्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha śvetaṃ kalaśaṃ ghobhir aktam āpipyānam maghavā śukram andhaḥ |
Translation: 5 And now let Maghavan accept the beaker, white, filled with milk, filled with the shining liquid;

Sanskit Text: अध्वर्युभिः परयतम मध्वो अग्रम इन्द्रो मदाय परति धत पिबध्यै शूरो मदाय परति धत पिबध्यै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhvaryubhiḥ prayatam madhvo aghram indro madāya prati dhat pibadhyai śūro madāya prati dhat pibadhyai ||
Translation: The best of sweet meath which the priests have offered: that Indra to his joy may drink, the Hero, that he may take and drink it to his rapture.

Sanskit Text: तवा युजा तव तत सोम सख्य इन्द्रो अपो मनवे सस्रुतस कः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvā yujā tava tat soma sakhya indro apo manave sasrutas kaḥ |
Translation: 1. ALLIED with thee, in this thy friendship, Soma, Indra for man made waters flow together,

Sanskit Text: अहन्न अहिम अरिणात सप्त सिन्धून अपाव्र्णोद अपिहितेव खानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahann ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn apāvṛṇod apihiteva khāni ||
Translation: Slew Ahi, and sent forth the Seven Rivers, and opened as it were obstructed fountains.

Sanskit Text: तवा युजा नि खिदत सूर्यस्येन्द्रश चक्रं सहसा सद्य इन्दो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvā yujā ni khidat sūryasyendraś cakraṃ sahasā sadya indo |
Translation: 2 Indu, with thee for his confederate, Indra swiftly with might pressed down the wheel of Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: अधि षणुना बर्हता वर्तमानम महो दरुहो अप विश्वायु धायि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi ṣṇunā bṛhatā vartamānam maho druho apa viśvāyu dhāyi ||
Translation: What rolled, all life's support, on heaven's high summit was separated from the great oppressor.

Sanskit Text: अहन्न इन्द्रो अदहद अग्निर इन्दो पुरा दस्यून मध्यंदिनाद अभीके |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahann indro adahad aghnir indo purā dasyūn madhyaṃdinād abhīke |
Translation: 3 Indra smote down, Agni consumed, O Indu, the Dasyus ere the noontide in the conflict.

Sanskit Text: दुर्गे दुरोणे करत्वा न याताम पुरू सहस्रा शर्वा नि बर्हीत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: durghe duroṇe kratvā na yātām purū sahasrā śarvā ni barhīt ||
Translation: Of those who gladly sought a hard-won dwelling he cast down many a thousand with his arrow.

Sanskit Text: विश्वस्मात सीम अधमां इन्द्र दस्यून विशो दासीर अक्र्णोर अप्रशस्ताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvasmāt sīm adhamāṃ indra dasyūn viśo dāsīr akṛṇor apraśastāḥ |
Translation: 4 Lower than all besides hast thou, O Indra, cast down the Dasyus, abject tribes of Dāsas.

Sanskit Text: अबाधेथाम अम्र्णतं नि शत्रून अविन्देथाम अपचितिं वधत्रैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abādhethām amṛṇataṃ ni śatrūn avindethām apacitiṃ vadhatraiḥ ||
Translation: Ye drave away, ye put to death the foemen, and took great vengeance with your murdering weapons.

Sanskit Text: एवा सत्यम मघवाना युवं तद इन्द्रश च सोमोर्वम अश्व्यं गोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā satyam maghavānā yuvaṃ tad indraś ca somorvam aśvyaṃ ghoḥ |
Translation: 5 So, of a truth, Indra and Soma, Heroes, ye burst the stable of the kine and horses,

Sanskit Text: आदर्द्र्तम अपिहितान्य अश्ना रिरिचथुः कषाश चित तत्र्दाना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādardṛtam apihitāny aśnā riricathuḥ kṣāś cit tatṛdānā ||
Translation: The stable which the bar or stone obstructed; and piercing through set free the habitations.

Sanskit Text: आ न सतुत उप वाजेभिर ऊती इन्द्र याहि हरिभिर मन्दसानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā na stuta upa vājebhir ūtī indra yāhi haribhir mandasānaḥ |
Translation: 1. COME, lauded, unto us with powers and succours, O Indra, with thy Tawny Steeds; exulting,

Sanskit Text: तिरश चिद अर्यः सवना पुरूण्य आङगूषेभिर गर्णानः सत्यराधाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tiraś cid aryaḥ savanā purūṇy āṅghūṣebhir ghṛṇānaḥ satyarādhāḥ ||
Translation: Past even the foeman's manifold libations, glorified with our hymns, true Wealth-bestower.

Sanskit Text: आ हि षमा याति नर्यश चिकित्वान हूयमानः सोत्र्भिर उप यज्ञम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā hi ṣmā yāti naryaś cikitvān hūyamānaḥ sotṛbhir upa yajñam |
Translation: 2 Man's Friend, to this our sacrifice he cometh marking how he is called by Soma-pressers.

Sanskit Text: सवश्वो यो अभीरुर मन्यमानः सुष्वाणेभिर मदति सं ह वीरैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svaśvo yo abhīrur manyamānaḥ suṣvāṇebhir madati saṃ ha vīraiḥ ||
Translation: Fearless, and conscious that his Steeds are noble, he joyeth with the Soma-pouring heroes.

Sanskit Text: शरावयेद अस्य कर्णा वाजयध्यै जुष्टाम अनु पर दिशम मन्दयध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrāvayed asya karṇā vājayadhyai juṣṭām anu pra diśam mandayadhyai |
Translation: 3 Make his cars hear, that he may show his vigour and may be joyful in the way he loveth.

Sanskit Text: उद्वाव्र्षाणो राधसे तुविष्मान करन न इन्द्रः सुतीर्थाभयं च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: udvāvṛṣāṇo rādhase tuviṣmān karan na indraḥ sutīrthābhayaṃ ca ||
Translation: May mighty Indra pouring forth in bounty bestow on us good roads and perfect safety;

Sanskit Text: अछा यो गन्ता नाधमानम ऊती इत्था विप्रं हवमानं गर्णन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā yo ghantā nādhamānam ūtī itthā vipraṃ havamānaṃ ghṛṇantam |
Translation: 4 He who with succour comes to his implorer, the singer here who with his song invites him;

Sanskit Text: उप तमनि दधानो धुर्य आशून सहस्राणि शतानि वज्रबाहुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa tmani dadhāno dhury āśūn sahasrāṇi śatāni vajrabāhuḥ ||
Translation: He who himself sets to the pole swift Coursers, he who hath hundreds, thousands, Thunder-wielder.

Sanskit Text: तवोतासो मघवन्न इन्द्र विप्रा वयं ते सयाम सूरयो गर्णन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvotāso maghavann indra viprā vayaṃ te syāma sūrayo ghṛṇantaḥ |
Translation: 5 O Indra Maghavan, by thee protected may we be thine, princes and priests and singers,

Sanskit Text: भेजानासो बर्हद्दिवस्य राय आकाय्यस्य दावने पुरुक्षोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhejānāso bṛhaddivasya rāya ākāyyasya dāvane purukṣoḥ ||
Translation: Sharing the riches sent from lofty heaven which yields much food, and all desire its bounty.

Sanskit Text: कया नश चित्र आ भुवद ऊती सदाव्र्धः सखा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kayā naś citra ā bhuvad ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā |
Translation: 1. WITH what help will he come to us, wonderful, ever-waxing Friend;

Sanskit Text: कया शचिष्ठया वर्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kayā śaciṣṭhayā vṛtā ||
Translation: With what most mighty company?

Sanskit Text: कस तवा सत्यो मदानाम मंहिष्ठो मत्सद अन्धसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kas tvā satyo madānām maṃhiṣṭho matsad andhasaḥ |
Translation: 2 What genuine and most liberal draught will spirit thee with juice to burst

Sanskit Text: दर्ळ्हा चिद आरुजे वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dṛḷhā cid āruje vasu ||
Translation: Open e’en strongly-guarded wealth?

Sanskit Text: अभी षु णः सखीनाम अविता जरित्णाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhī ṣu ṇaḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṇām |
Translation: 3 Do thou who art Protector of us thy friends who praise thee

Sanskit Text: शतम भवास्य ऊतिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śatam bhavāsy ūtibhiḥ ||
Translation: With hundred aids approach us.

Sanskit Text: अभी न आ वव्र्त्स्व चक्रं न वर्त्तम अर्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhī na ā vavṛtsva cakraṃ na vṛttam arvataḥ |
Translation: 4 Like as a courser's circling wheel, so turn thee hitherward to us,

Sanskit Text: नियुद्भिश चर्षणीनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niyudbhiś carṣaṇīnām ||
Translation: Attracted by the hymns of men.

Sanskit Text: परवता हि करतूनाम आ हा पदेव गछसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pravatā hi kratūnām ā hā padeva ghachasi |
Translation: 5 Thou seekest as it were thine own stations with swift descent of powers:

Sanskit Text: अभक्षि सूर्ये सचा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhakṣi sūrye sacā ||
Translation: I share thee even with the Sun.

Sanskit Text: सं यत त इन्द्र मन्यवः सं चक्राणि दधन्विरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yat ta indra manyavaḥ saṃ cakrāṇi dadhanvire |
Translation: 6 What time thy courage and his wheels together, Indra, run their course

Sanskit Text: अध तवे अध सूर्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha tve adha sūrye ||
Translation: With thee and with the Sun alike,

Sanskit Text: उत समा हि तवाम आहुर इन मघवानं शचीपते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta smā hi tvām āhur in maghavānaṃ śacīpate |
Translation: 7 So even, Lord of Power and Might, the people call thee Maghavan,

Sanskit Text: दातारम अविदीधयुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dātāram avidīdhayum ||
Translation: Giver, who pauses not to think.

Sanskit Text: उत समा सद्य इत परि शशमानाय सुन्वते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta smā sadya it pari śaśamānāya sunvate |
Translation: 8 And verily to him who toils and presses Soma juice for thee

Sanskit Text: पुरू चिन मंहसे वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purū cin maṃhase vasu ||
Translation: Thou quickly givest ample wealth.

Sanskit Text: नहि षमा ते शतं चन राधो वरन्त आमुरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi ṣmā te śataṃ cana rādho varanta āmuraḥ |
Translation: 9 No, not a hundred hinderers can check thy gracious bounty's flow,

Sanskit Text: न चयौत्नानि करिष्यतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na cyautnāni kariṣyataḥ ||
Translation: Nor thy great deeds when thou wilt act.

Sanskit Text: अस्मां अवन्तु ते शतम अस्मान सहस्रम ऊतयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmāṃ avantu te śatam asmān sahasram ūtayaḥ |
Translation: 10 May thine assistance keep us safe, thy hundred and thy thousand aids:

Sanskit Text: अस्मान विश्वा अभिष्टयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmān viśvā abhiṣṭayaḥ ||
Translation: May all thy favours strengthen us.

Sanskit Text: अस्मां इहा वर्णीष्व सख्याय सवस्तये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmāṃ ihā vṛṇīṣva sakhyāya svastaye |
Translation: 11 Do thou elect us this place for friendship and prosperity,

Sanskit Text: महो राये दिवित्मते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maho rāye divitmate ||
Translation: And great celestial opulence.

Sanskit Text: अस्मां अविड्ढि विश्वहेन्द्र राया परीणसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmāṃ aviḍḍhi viśvahendra rāyā parīṇasā |
Translation: 12 Favour us, Indra, evermore with overflowing store of wealth:

Sanskit Text: अस्मान विश्वाभिर ऊतिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmān viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ ||
Translation: With all thy succours aid thou us.

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं तां अपा वर्धि वरजां अस्तेव गोमतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ tāṃ apā vṛdhi vrajāṃ asteva ghomataḥ |
Translation: 13 With new protections, Indra, like an archer, open thou for us

Sanskit Text: नवाभिर इन्द्रोतिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: navābhir indrotibhiḥ ||
Translation: The stables that are filled with kine.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकं धर्ष्णुया रथो दयुमां इन्द्रानपच्युतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākaṃ dhṛṣṇuyā ratho dyumāṃ indrānapacyutaḥ |
Translation: 14 Our chariot, Indra, boldly moves endued with splendour, ne’er repulsed,

Sanskit Text: गव्युर अश्वयुर ईयते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghavyur aśvayur īyate ||
Translation: Winning for us both kine and steeds.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकम उत्तमं कर्धि शरवो देवेषु सूर्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākam uttamaṃ kṛdhi śravo deveṣu sūrya |
Translation: 15 O Sūrya, make our fame to be most excellent among the Gods,

Sanskit Text: वर्षिष्ठं दयाम इवोपरि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: varṣiṣṭhaṃ dyām ivopari ||
Translation: Most lofty as the heaven on high.

Sanskit Text: आ तू न इन्द्र वर्त्रहन्न अस्माकम अर्धम आ गहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tū na indra vṛtrahann asmākam ardham ā ghahi |
Translation: 1. O THOU who slewest Vṛtra, come, O Indra, hither to our side,

Sanskit Text: महान महीभिर ऊतिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahān mahībhir ūtibhiḥ ||
Translation: Mighty One with thy mighty aids.

Sanskit Text: भर्मिश चिद घासि तूतुजिर आ चित्र चित्रिणीष्व आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhṛmiś cid ghāsi tūtujir ā citra citriṇīṣv ā |
Translation: 2 Swift and impetuous art thou, wondrous amid the well-dressed folk:

Sanskit Text: चित्रं कर्णोष्य ऊतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: citraṃ kṛṇoṣy ūtaye ||
Translation: Thou doest marvels for our help.

Sanskit Text: दभ्रेभिश चिच छशीयांसं हंसि वराधन्तम ओजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dabhrebhiś cic chaśīyāṃsaṃ haṃsi vrādhantam ojasā |
Translation: 3 Even with the weak thou smitest down him

Sanskit Text: सखिभिर ये तवे सचा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhibhir ye tve sacā ||
Translation: who is stronger, with thy strength

Sanskit Text: वयम इन्द्र तवे सचा वयं तवाभि नोनुमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayam indra tve sacā vayaṃ tvābhi nonumaḥ |
Translation: The mighty, with the Friends thou hast.

Sanskit Text: अस्मां-अस्मां इद उद अव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmāṃ-asmāṃ id ud ava ||
Translation: 4 O Indra, we are close to thee; to thee we sing aloud our songs:

Sanskit Text: स नश चित्राभिर अद्रिवो ऽनवद्याभिर ऊतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naś citrābhir adrivo 'navadyābhir ūtibhiḥ |
Translation: Help and defend us, even us.

Sanskit Text: अनाध्र्ष्टाभिर आ गहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anādhṛṣṭābhir ā ghahi ||
Translation: 5 As such, O Caster of the Stone, come with thy succours wonderful,

Sanskit Text: भूयामो षु तवावतः सखाय इन्द्र गोमतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūyāmo ṣu tvāvataḥ sakhāya indra ghomataḥ |
Translation: Blameless, and irresistible.

Sanskit Text: युजो वाजाय घर्ष्वये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yujo vājāya ghṛṣvaye ||
Translation: 6 May we be friends of one like thee, O Indra, with the wealth of kine,

Sanskit Text: तवं हय एक ईशिष इन्द्र वाजस्य गोमतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hy eka īśiṣa indra vājasya ghomataḥ |
Translation: Comrades for lively energy.

Sanskit Text: स नो यन्धि महीम इषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no yandhi mahīm iṣam ||
Translation: 7 For thou, O Indra, art alone the Lord of strength that comes from kine

Sanskit Text: न तवा वरन्ते अन्यथा यद दित्ससि सतुतो मघम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na tvā varante anyathā yad ditsasi stuto magham |
Translation: So grant thou us abundant food.

Sanskit Text: सतोत्र्भ्य इन्द्र गिर्वणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stotṛbhya indra ghirvaṇaḥ ||
Translation: 8 They turn thee not another way, when, lauded, Lover of the Song,

Sanskit Text: अभि तवा गोतमा गिरानूषत पर दावने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tvā ghotamā ghirānūṣata pra dāvane |
Translation: Thou wilt give wealth to those who praise.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र वाजाय घर्ष्वये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra vājāya ghṛṣvaye ||
Translation: 9 The Gotamas have sung their song of praise to thee that thou mayst give,

Sanskit Text: पर ते वोचाम वीर्या या मन्दसान आरुजः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te vocāma vīryā yā mandasāna ārujaḥ |
Translation: Indra, for lively energy.

Sanskit Text: पुरो दासीर अभीत्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: puro dāsīr abhītya ||
Translation: 10 We will declare thy hero deeds, what Dāsa forts thou brakest down,

Sanskit Text: ता ते गर्णन्ति वेधसो यानि चकर्थ पौंस्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā te ghṛṇanti vedhaso yāni cakartha pauṃsyā |
Translation: Attacking them in rapturous joy.

Sanskit Text: सुतेष्व इन्द्र गिर्वणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suteṣv indra ghirvaṇaḥ ||
Translation: 11 The sages sing those manly deeds which, Indra, Lover of the Song,

Sanskit Text: अवीव्र्धन्त गोतमा इन्द्र तवे सतोमवाहसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avīvṛdhanta ghotamā indra tve stomavāhasaḥ |
Translation: Thou wroughtest when the Soma flowed.

Sanskit Text: ऐषु धा वीरवद यशः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aiṣu dhā vīravad yaśaḥ ||
Translation: 12 Indra, the Gotamas who bring thee praises have grown strong by thee.

Sanskit Text: यच चिद धि शश्वताम असीन्द्र साधारणस तवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yac cid dhi śaśvatām asīndra sādhāraṇas tvam |
Translation: Give them renown with hero sons.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा वयं हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā vayaṃ havāmahe ||
Translation: 13 For, Indra, verily thou art the general treasure even of all .

Sanskit Text: अर्वाचीनो वसो भवास्मे सु मत्स्वान्धसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvācīno vaso bhavāsme su matsvāndhasaḥ |
Translation: Thee, therefore, do we invocate.

Sanskit Text: सोमानाम इन्द्र सोमपाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somānām indra somapāḥ ||
Translation: 14 Excellent Indra, turn to us: glad thee among us with the juice

Sanskit Text: अस्माकं तवा मतीनाम आ सतोम इन्द्र यछतु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākaṃ tvā matīnām ā stoma indra yachatu |
Translation: Of Somas, Soma-drinker thou.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाग आ वर्तया हरी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāgh ā vartayā harī ||
Translation: 15 May praise from us who think Qn thee, O Indra, bring thee near to us.

Sanskit Text: पुरोळाशं च नो घसो जोषयासे गिरश च नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: puroḷāśaṃ ca no ghaso joṣayāse ghiraś ca naḥ |
Translation: Turn thy two Bay Steeds hitherward.

Sanskit Text: वधूयुर इव योषणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vadhūyur iva yoṣaṇām ||
Translation: 16 Eat of our sacrificial cake: rejoice thee in the songs we sing.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रं वयतीनां युक्तानाम इन्द्रम ईमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasraṃ vyatīnāṃ yuktānām indram īmahe |
Translation: Even as a lover in his bride.

Sanskit Text: शतं सोमस्य खार्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ somasya khāryaḥ ||
Translation: 17 To India for a thousand steeds well-trained and fleet of foot we pray,

Sanskit Text: सहस्रा ते शता वयं गवाम आ चयावयामसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasrā te śatā vayaṃ ghavām ā cyāvayāmasi |
Translation: And hundred jars of Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: अस्मत्रा राध एतु ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmatrā rādha etu te ||
Translation: 18 We make a hundred of thy kine, yea, and a thousand, hasten nigh:

Sanskit Text: दश ते कलशानां हिरण्यानाम अधीमहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśa te kalaśānāṃ hiraṇyānām adhīmahi |
Translation: So let thy bounty come to us.

Sanskit Text: भूरिदा असि वर्त्रहन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūridā asi vṛtrahan ||
Translation: 19 We have obtained, a gift from thee, ten water-ewers wrought of gold:

Sanskit Text: भूरिदा भूरि देहि नो मा दभ्रम भूर्य आ भर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūridā bhūri dehi no mā dabhram bhūry ā bhara |
Translation: Thou, Vṛtra-slayer, givest much.

Sanskit Text: भूरि घेद इन्द्र दित्ससि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūri ghed indra ditsasi ||
Translation: 20 A bounteous Giver, give us much, bring much and not a trifling gift:

Sanskit Text: भूरिदा हय असि शरुतः पुरुत्रा शूर वर्त्रहन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūridā hy asi śrutaḥ purutrā śūra vṛtrahan |
Translation: Much, Indra, wilt thou fain bestow.

Sanskit Text: आ नो भजस्व राधसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no bhajasva rādhasi ||
Translation: 21 O Vṛtra-slayer, thou art famed in many a place as bountiful

Sanskit Text: पर ते बभ्रू विचक्षण शंसामि गोषणो नपात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te babhrū vicakṣaṇa śaṃsāmi ghoṣaṇo napāt |
Translation: Hero, thy bounty let us share.

Sanskit Text: माभ्यां गा अनु शिश्रथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mābhyāṃ ghā anu śiśrathaḥ ||
Translation: 22 I praise thy pair of Tawny Steeds, wise Son of him who giveth kine

Sanskit Text: कनीनकेव विद्रधे नवे दरुपदे अर्भके |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kanīnakeva vidradhe nave drupade arbhake |
Translation: Terrify not the cows with these.

Sanskit Text: बभ्रू यामेषु शोभेते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: babhrū yāmeṣu śobhete ||
Translation: 23 Like two slight images of girls, unrobed, upon a new-wrought post,

Sanskit Text: अरम म उस्रयाम्णे ऽरम अनुस्रयाम्णे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aram ma usrayāmṇe 'ram anusrayāmṇe |
Translation: So shine the Bay Steeds in their course.

Sanskit Text: बभ्रू यामेष्व अस्रिधा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: babhrū yāmeṣv asridhā ||
Translation: 24 For me the Bays are ready when I start, or start not, with the dawn, Innocuous in the ways they take.

Sanskit Text: पर रभुभ्यो दूतम इव वाचम इष्य उपस्तिरे शवैतरीं धेनुम ईळे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ṛbhubhyo dūtam iva vācam iṣya upastire śvaitarīṃ dhenum īḷe |
Translation: 1. I SEND my voice as herald to the Ṛbhus; I crave the white cow for the overspreading.

Sanskit Text: ये वातजूतास तरणिभिर एवैः परि दयां सद्यो अपसो बभूवुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye vātajūtās taraṇibhir evaiḥ pari dyāṃ sadyo apaso babhūvuḥ ||
Translation: Wind-sped, the Skillful Ones in rapid motion have in an instant compassed round the heaven.

Sanskit Text: यदारम अक्रन्न रभवः पित्र्भ्याम परिविष्टी वेषणा दंसनाभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadāram akrann ṛbhavaḥ pitṛbhyām pariviṣṭī veṣaṇā daṃsanābhiḥ |
Translation: 2 What time the Rbus had with care and marvels done proper service to assist their Parents,

Sanskit Text: आद इद देवानाम उप सख्यम आयन धीरासः पुष्टिम अवहन मनायै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ād id devānām upa sakhyam āyan dhīrāsaḥ puṣṭim avahan manāyai ||
Translation: They won the friendship of the Gods; the Sages carried away the fruit of their devotion.

Sanskit Text: पुनर ये चक्रुः पितरा युवाना सना यूपेव जरणा शयाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: punar ye cakruḥ pitarā yuvānā sanā yūpeva jaraṇā śayānā |
Translation: 3 May they who made their Parents, who were lying like posts that moulder, young again for ever,—

Sanskit Text: ते वाजो विभ्वां रभुर इन्द्रवन्तो मधुप्सरसो नो ऽवन्तु यज्ञम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te vājo vibhvāṃ ṛbhur indravanto madhupsaraso no 'vantu yajñam ||
Translation: May Vāja, Vibhvan, Ṛbhu, joined with Indra , protect our sacrifice, the Soma-lovers.

Sanskit Text: यत संवत्सम रभवो गाम अरक्षन यत संवत्सम रभवो मा अपिंशन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat saṃvatsam ṛbhavo ghām arakṣan yat saṃvatsam ṛbhavo mā apiṃśan |
Translation: 4 As for a year the Ṛbhus kept the Milch-cow, throughout a year fashioned and formed her body,

Sanskit Text: यत संवत्सम अभरन भासो अस्यास ताभिः शमीभिर अम्र्तत्वम आशुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat saṃvatsam abharan bhāso asyās tābhiḥ śamībhir amṛtatvam āśuḥ ||
Translation: And through a year's space still sustained her brightness, through these their labours they were made immortal.

Sanskit Text: जयेष्ठ आह चमसा दवा करेति कनीयान तरीन कर्णवामेत्य आह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyeṣṭha āha camasā dvā kareti kanīyān trīn kṛṇavāmety āha |
Translation: 5 Two beakers let us make,—thus said the eldest. Let us make three,—this was the younger's sentence.

Sanskit Text: कनिष्ठ आह चतुरस करेति तवष्ट रभवस तत पनयद वचो वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaniṣṭha āha caturas kareti tvaṣṭa ṛbhavas tat panayad vaco vaḥ ||
Translation: Four beakers let us make,—thus spoke the youngest. Tvaṣṭar approved this rede of yours, O Ṛbhus.

Sanskit Text: सत्यम ऊचुर नर एवा हि चक्रुर अनु सवधाम रभवो जग्मुर एताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satyam ūcur nara evā hi cakrur anu svadhām ṛbhavo jaghmur etām |
Translation: 6 The men spake truth and even so they acted: this Godlike way of theirs the Ṛbhus followed.

Sanskit Text: विभ्राजमानांश चमसां अहेवावेनत तवष्टा चतुरो दद्र्श्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vibhrājamānāṃś camasāṃ ahevāvenat tvaṣṭā caturo dadṛśvān ||
Translation: And Tvaṣṭar, when he looked on the four beakers resplendent as the day, was moved with envy.

Sanskit Text: दवादश दयून यद अगोह्यस्यातिथ्ये रणन्न रभवः ससन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvādaśa dyūn yad aghohyasyātithye raṇann ṛbhavaḥ sasantaḥ |
Translation: 7 When for twelve days the Ṛbhus joyed reposing as guests of him who never may be hidden,

Sanskit Text: सुक्षेत्राक्र्ण्वन्न अनयन्त सिन्धून धन्वातिष्ठन्न ओषधीर निम्नम आपः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sukṣetrākṛṇvann anayanta sindhūn dhanvātiṣṭhann oṣadhīr nimnam āpaḥ ||
Translation: They made fair fertile fields, they brought the rivers. Plants spread o’er deserts, waters filled the hollows.

Sanskit Text: रथं ये चक्रुः सुव्र्तं नरेष्ठां ये धेनुं विश्वजुवं विश्वरूपाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathaṃ ye cakruḥ suvṛtaṃ nareṣṭhāṃ ye dhenuṃ viśvajuvaṃ viśvarūpām |
Translation: 8 May they who formed the swift car, bearing Heroes, and the Cow omniform and all-impelling,

Sanskit Text: त आ तक्षन्त्व रभवो रयिं नः सववसः सवपसः सुहस्ताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta ā takṣantv ṛbhavo rayiṃ naḥ svavasaḥ svapasaḥ suhastāḥ ||
Translation: Even may they form wealth for us,—the Ṛbhus, dexterous-handed, deft in work and gracious.

Sanskit Text: अपो हय एषाम अजुषन्त देवा अभि करत्वा मनसा दीध्यानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apo hy eṣām ajuṣanta devā abhi kratvā manasā dīdhyānāḥ |
Translation: 9 So in their work the Gods had satisfaction, pondering it with thought and mental insight.

Sanskit Text: वाजो देवानाम अभवत सुकर्मेन्द्रस्य रभुक्षा वरुणस्य विभ्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājo devānām abhavat sukarmendrasya ṛbhukṣā varuṇasya vibhvā ||
Translation: The Gods’ expert artificer was Vāja, Indra's Ṛbhukṣan, Varuṇa's was Vibhvan.

Sanskit Text: ये हरी मेधयोक्था मदन्त इन्द्राय चक्रुः सुयुजा ये अश्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye harī medhayokthā madanta indrāya cakruḥ suyujā ye aśvā |
Translation: 10 They who made glad with sacrifice and praises, wrought the two Bays, his docile Steeds, for Indra,—

Sanskit Text: ते रायस पोषं दरविणान्य अस्मे धत्त रभवः कषेमयन्तो न मित्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te rāyas poṣaṃ draviṇāny asme dhatta ṛbhavaḥ kṣemayanto na mitram ||
Translation: Ṛbhus, as those who wish a friend to prosper, bestow upon us gear and growth of riches.

Sanskit Text: इदाह्नः पीतिम उत वो मदं धुर न रते शरान्तस्य सख्याय देवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idāhnaḥ pītim uta vo madaṃ dhur na ṛte śrāntasya sakhyāya devāḥ |
Translation: 11 This day have they set gladdening drink before you. Not without toil are Gods inclined to friendship.

Sanskit Text: ते नूनम अस्मे रभवो वसूनि तर्तीये अस्मिन सवने दधात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te nūnam asme ṛbhavo vasūni tṛtīye asmin savane dadhāta ||
Translation: Therefore do ye who are so great, O Ṛbhus, vouchsafe us treasures at this third libation.

Sanskit Text: रभुर विभ्वा वाज इन्द्रो नो अछेमं यज्ञं रत्नधेयोप यात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛbhur vibhvā vāja indro no achemaṃ yajñaṃ ratnadheyopa yāta |
Translation: 1. To this our sacrifice come Ṛbhu, Vibhvan, Vāja, and Indra with the gift of riches,

Sanskit Text: इदा हि वो धिषणा देव्य अह्नाम अधात पीतिं सम मदा अग्मता वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: idā hi vo dhiṣaṇā devy ahnām adhāt pītiṃ sam madā aghmatā vaḥ ||
Translation: Because this day hath Dhiṣaṇā the Goddess set drink for you: the gladdening draughts have reached you.

Sanskit Text: विदानासो जन्मनो वाजरत्ना उत रतुभिर रभवो मादयध्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidānāso janmano vājaratnā uta ṛtubhir ṛbhavo mādayadhvam |
Translation: 2 Knowing your birth and rich in gathered treasure, Ṛbhus, rejoice together with the Ṛtus.

Sanskit Text: सं वो मदा अग्मत सम पुरंधिः सुवीराम अस्मे रयिम एरयध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ vo madā aghmata sam puraṃdhiḥ suvīrām asme rayim erayadhvam ||
Translation: The gladdening draughts and wisdom have approached you: send ye us riches with good store of heroes.

Sanskit Text: अयं वो यज्ञ रभवो ऽकारि यम आ मनुष्वत परदिवो दधिध्वे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ vo yajña ṛbhavo 'kāri yam ā manuṣvat pradivo dadhidhve |
Translation: 3 For you was made this sacrifice, O Ṛbhus, which ye, like men, won for yourselves aforetime.

Sanskit Text: पर वो ऽछा जुजुषाणासो अस्थुर अभूत विश्वे अग्रियोत वाजाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vo 'chā jujuṣāṇāso asthur abhūta viśve aghriyota vājāḥ ||
Translation: To you come all who find in you their pleasure: ye all were—even the two elder—Vājas.

Sanskit Text: अभूद उ वो विधते रत्नधेयम इदा नरो दाशुषे मर्त्याय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhūd u vo vidhate ratnadheyam idā naro dāśuṣe martyāya |
Translation: 4 Now for the mortal worshipper, O Heroes, for him who served you, was the gift of riches.

Sanskit Text: पिबत वाजा रभवो ददे वो महि तर्तीयं सवनम मदाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibata vājā ṛbhavo dade vo mahi tṛtīyaṃ savanam madāya ||
Translation: Drink, Vājas, Ṛbhus! unto you is offered, to gladden you, the third and great libation.

Sanskit Text: आ वाजा यातोप न रभुक्षा महो नरो दरविणसो गर्णानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vājā yātopa na ṛbhukṣā maho naro draviṇaso ghṛṇānāḥ |
Translation: 5 Come to us, Heroes, Vājas and Ṛbhukṣans, glorified for the sake of mighty treasure.

Sanskit Text: आ वः पीतयो ऽभिपित्वे अह्नाम इमा अस्तं नवस्व इव गमन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vaḥ pītayo 'bhipitve ahnām imā astaṃ navasva iva ghman ||
Translation: These draughts approach you as the day is closing, as cows, whose calves are newly-born, their stable.

Sanskit Text: आ नपातः शवसो यातनोपेमं यज्ञं नमसा हूयमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā napātaḥ śavaso yātanopemaṃ yajñaṃ namasā hūyamānāḥ |
Translation: 6 Come to this sacrifice of ours, ye Children of Strength, invoked with humble adoration.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसः सूरयो यस्य च सथ मध्वः पात रत्नधा इन्द्रवन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasaḥ sūrayo yasya ca stha madhvaḥ pāta ratnadhā indravantaḥ ||
Translation: Drink of this meath, Wealth-givers, joined with Indra with whom ye are in full accord, ye Princes.

Sanskit Text: सजोषा इन्द्र वरुणेन सोमं सजोषाः पाहि गिर्वणो मरुद्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣā indra varuṇena somaṃ sajoṣāḥ pāhi ghirvaṇo marudbhiḥ |
Translation: 7 Close knit with Varuṇa drink the Soma, Indra; close-knit, Hymn-lover! with the Maruts drink it:

Sanskit Text: अग्रेपाभिर रतुपाभिः सजोषा गनास्पत्नीभी रत्नधाभिः सजोषाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghrepābhir ṛtupābhiḥ sajoṣā ghnāspatnībhī ratnadhābhiḥ sajoṣāḥ ||
Translation: Close-knit with drinkers first, who drink in season; close-knit with heavenly Dames who give us treasures.

Sanskit Text: सजोषस आदित्यैर मादयध्वं सजोषस रभवः पर्वतेभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasa ādityair mādayadhvaṃ sajoṣasa ṛbhavaḥ parvatebhiḥ |
Translation: 8 Rejoice in full accord with the Ādityas, in concord with the Parvatas, O Ṛbhus;

Sanskit Text: सजोषसो दैव्येना सवित्रा सजोषसः सिन्धुभी रत्नधेभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣaso daivyenā savitrā sajoṣasaḥ sindhubhī ratnadhebhiḥ ||
Translation: In full accord with Savitar, Divine One; in full accord with floods that pour forth riches.

Sanskit Text: ये अश्विना ये पितरा य ऊती धेनुं ततक्षुर रभवो ये अश्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye aśvinā ye pitarā ya ūtī dhenuṃ tatakṣur ṛbhavo ye aśvā |
Translation: 9 Ṛbhus, who helped their Parents and the Aśvins, who formed the Milch-cow and the pair of horses,

Sanskit Text: ये अंसत्रा य रधग रोदसी ये विभ्वो नरः सवपत्यानि चक्रुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye aṃsatrā ya ṛdhagh rodasī ye vibhvo naraḥ svapatyāni cakruḥ ||
Translation: Made armour, set the heaven and earth asunder,—far- reaching Heroes, they have made good offspring.

Sanskit Text: ये गोमन्तं वाजवन्तं सुवीरं रयिं धत्थ वसुमन्तम पुरुक्षुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye ghomantaṃ vājavantaṃ suvīraṃ rayiṃ dhattha vasumantam purukṣum |
Translation: 10 Ye who have wealth in cattle and in booty, in heroes, in rich sustenance and treasure,

Sanskit Text: ते अग्रेपा रभवो मन्दसाना अस्मे धत्त ये च रातिं गर्णन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te aghrepā ṛbhavo mandasānā asme dhatta ye ca rātiṃ ghṛṇanti ||
Translation: Such, O ye Ṛbhus, first to drink, rejoicing, give unto us and those who laud our present.

Sanskit Text: नापाभूत न वो ऽतीत्र्षामानिःशस्ता रभवो यज्ञे अस्मिन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāpābhūta na vo 'tītṛṣāmāniḥśastā ṛbhavo yajñe asmin |
Translation: 11 Ye were not far: we have not left you thirsting, blameless in this our sacrifice, O Ṛbhus.

Sanskit Text: सम इन्द्रेण मदथ सम मरुद्भिः सं राजभी रत्नधेयाय देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sam indreṇa madatha sam marudbhiḥ saṃ rājabhī ratnadheyāya devāḥ ||
Translation: Rejoice you with the Maruts and with Indra, with the Kings, Gods! that ye may give us riches.

Sanskit Text: इहोप यात शवसो नपातः सौधन्वना रभवो माप भूत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ihopa yāta śavaso napātaḥ saudhanvanā ṛbhavo māpa bhūta |
Translation: 1. Come hither, O ye Sons of Strength, ye Ṛbhus; stay not afar, ye Children of Sudhanvan.

Sanskit Text: अस्मिन हि वः सवने रत्नधेयं गमन्त्व इन्द्रम अनु वो मदासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmin hi vaḥ savane ratnadheyaṃ ghamantv indram anu vo madāsaḥ ||
Translation: At this libation is your gift of treasure. Let gladdening draughts approach you after Indra's.

Sanskit Text: आगन्न रभूणाम इह रत्नधेयम अभूत सोमस्य सुषुतस्य पीतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āghann ṛbhūṇām iha ratnadheyam abhūt somasya suṣutasya pītiḥ |
Translation: 2 Hither is come the Ṛbhus' gift of riches; here was the drinking of the well-pressed Soma,

Sanskit Text: सुक्र्त्यया यत सवपस्यया चं एकं विचक्र चमसं चतुर्धा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sukṛtyayā yat svapasyayā caṃ ekaṃ vicakra camasaṃ caturdhā ||
Translation: Since by dexterity and skill as craftsmen ye made the single chalice to be fourfold

Sanskit Text: वय अक्र्णोत चमसं चतुर्धा सखे वि शिक्षेत्य अब्रवीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vy akṛṇota camasaṃ caturdhā sakhe vi śikṣety abravīta |
Translation: 3 Ye made fourfold the chalice that wag single: ye spake these words and said, O Friend, assist us;

Sanskit Text: अथैत वाजा अम्र्तस्य पन्थां गणं देवानाम रभवः सुहस्ताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athaita vājā amṛtasya panthāṃ ghaṇaṃ devānām ṛbhavaḥ suhastāḥ ||
Translation: Then, Vājas! gained the path of life eternal, deft-handed Ṛbhus, to the Gods’ assembly.

Sanskit Text: किम्मयः सविच चमस एष आस यं काव्येन चतुरो विचक्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kimmayaḥ svic camasa eṣa āsa yaṃ kāvyena caturo vicakra |
Translation: 4 Out of what substance was that chalice fashioned which ye made fourfold by your art and wisdom?

Sanskit Text: अथा सुनुध्वं सवनम मदाय पात रभवो मधुनः सोम्यस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā sunudhvaṃ savanam madāya pāta ṛbhavo madhunaḥ somyasya ||
Translation: Now for the gladdening draught press out the liquor, and drink, O Ṛbhus, of die meath of Soma.

Sanskit Text: शच्याकर्त पितरा युवाना शच्याकर्त चमसं देवपानम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śacyākarta pitarā yuvānā śacyākarta camasaṃ devapānam |
Translation: 5 Ye with your cunning made your Parents youthful; the cup, for Gods to drink, ye formed with cunning;

Sanskit Text: शच्या हरी धनुतराव अतष्टेन्द्रवाहाव रभवो वाजरत्नाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śacyā harī dhanutarāv ataṣṭendravāhāv ṛbhavo vājaratnāḥ ||
Translation: With cunning, Ṛbhus, rich in treasure, fashioned the two swift Tawny Steeds who carry Indra.

Sanskit Text: यो वः सुनोत्य अभिपित्वे अह्नां तीव्रं वाजासः सवनम मदाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vaḥ sunoty abhipitve ahnāṃ tīvraṃ vājāsaḥ savanam madāya |
Translation: 6 Whoso pours out for you, when days are closing, the sharp libation for your joy, O Vājas,

Sanskit Text: तस्मै रयिम रभवः सर्ववीरम आ तक्षत वर्षणो मन्दसानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmai rayim ṛbhavaḥ sarvavīram ā takṣata vṛṣaṇo mandasānāḥ ||
Translation: For him, O mighty Ṛbhus, ye, rejoicing, have fashioned wealth with plenteous store of heroes.

Sanskit Text: परातः सुतम अपिबो हर्यश्व माध्यंदिनं सवनं केवलं ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātaḥ sutam apibo haryaśva mādhyaṃdinaṃ savanaṃ kevalaṃ te |
Translation: 7 Lord of Bay Steeds, at dawn the juice thou drankest: thine, only thine, is the noonday libation.

Sanskit Text: सम रभुभिः पिबस्व रत्नधेभिः सखींर यां इन्द्र चक्र्षे सुक्र्त्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sam ṛbhubhiḥ pibasva ratnadhebhiḥ sakhīṃr yāṃ indra cakṛṣe sukṛtyā ||
Translation: Now drink thou with the wealth-bestowing Ṛbhus, whom for their skill thou madest friends, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: ये देवासो अभवता सुक्र्त्या शयेना इवेद अधि दिवि निषेद |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye devāso abhavatā sukṛtyā śyenā ived adhi divi niṣeda |
Translation: 8 Ye, whom your artist skill hath raised to Godhead have set you down above in heaven like falcons.

Sanskit Text: ते रत्नं धात शवसो नपातः सौधन्वना अभवताम्र्तासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te ratnaṃ dhāta śavaso napātaḥ saudhanvanā abhavatāmṛtāsaḥ ||
Translation: So give us riches, Children of Sudhanvan, O Sons of Strength; ye have become immortal.

Sanskit Text: यत तर्तीयं सवनं रत्नधेयम अक्र्णुध्वं सवपस्या सुहस्ताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat tṛtīyaṃ savanaṃ ratnadheyam akṛṇudhvaṃ svapasyā suhastāḥ |
Translation: 9 The third libation, that bestoweth treasure, which ye have won by skill, ye dexterous-handed,—

Sanskit Text: तद रभवः परिषिक्तं व एतत सम मदेभिर इन्द्रियेभिः पिबध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad ṛbhavaḥ pariṣiktaṃ va etat sam madebhir indriyebhiḥ pibadhvam ||
Translation: This drink hath been effused for you, O Ṛbhus . drink it with high delight, with joy like Indra's.

Sanskit Text: अनश्वो जातो अनभीशुर उक्थ्यो रथस तरिचक्रः परि वर्तते रजः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anaśvo jāto anabhīśur ukthyo rathas tricakraḥ pari vartate rajaḥ |
Translation: 1. THE car that was not made for horses or for reins, three-wheeled, worthy of lauds, rolls round the firmament.

Sanskit Text: महत तद वो देव्यस्य परवाचनं दयाम रभवः पर्थिवीं यच च पुष्यथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahat tad vo devyasya pravācanaṃ dyām ṛbhavaḥ pṛthivīṃ yac ca puṣyatha ||
Translation: That is the great announcement of your Deity, that, O ye Ṛbhus, ye sustain the earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: रथं ये चक्रुः सुव्र्तं सुचेतसो ऽविह्वरन्तम मनसस परि धयया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathaṃ ye cakruḥ suvṛtaṃ sucetaso 'vihvarantam manasas pari dhyayā |
Translation: 2 Ye Sapient Ones who made the lightly-rolling car out of your mind, by thought, the car that never errs,

Sanskit Text: तां ऊ नव अस्य सवनस्य पीतय आ वो वाजा रभवो वेदयामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāṃ ū nv asya savanasya pītaya ā vo vājā ṛbhavo vedayāmasi ||
Translation: You, being such, to drink of this drink-offering, you, O ye Vājas, and ye Ṛbhus, we invoke.

Sanskit Text: तद वो वाजा रभवः सुप्रवाचनं देवेषु विभ्वो अभवन महित्वनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad vo vājā ṛbhavaḥ supravācanaṃ deveṣu vibhvo abhavan mahitvanam |
Translation: 3 O Vājas, Ṛbhus, reaching far, among the Gods this was your exaltation gloriously declared,

Sanskit Text: जिव्री यत सन्ता पितरा सनाजुरा पुनर युवाना चरथाय तक्षथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jivrī yat santā pitarā sanājurā punar yuvānā carathāya takṣatha ||
Translation: In that your aged Parents, worn with length of days, ye wrought again to youth so that they moved at will.

Sanskit Text: एकं वि चक्र चमसं चतुर्वयं निश चर्मणो गाम अरिणीत धीतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ekaṃ vi cakra camasaṃ caturvayaṃ niś carmaṇo ghām ariṇīta dhītibhiḥ |
Translation: 4 The chalice that wag single ye have made fourfold, and by your wisdom brought the Cow forth from the hide.

Sanskit Text: अथा देवेष्व अम्र्तत्वम आनश शरुष्टी वाजा रभवस तद व उक्थ्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā deveṣv amṛtatvam ānaśa śruṣṭī vājā ṛbhavas tad va ukthyam ||
Translation: So quickly, mid the Gods, ye gained immortal life. Vājas and Ṛbhus, your great work must be extolled.

Sanskit Text: रभुतो रयिः परथमश्रवस्तमो वाजश्रुतासो यम अजीजनन नरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛbhuto rayiḥ prathamaśravastamo vājaśrutāso yam ajījanan naraḥ |
Translation: 5 Wealth from the Ṛbhus is most glorious in renown, that which the Heroes, famed for vigour, have produced.

Sanskit Text: विभ्वतष्टो विदथेषु परवाच्यो यं देवासो ऽवथा स विचर्षणिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vibhvataṣṭo vidatheṣu pravācyo yaṃ devāso 'vathā sa vicarṣaṇiḥ ||
Translation: In synods must be sung the car which Vibhvan wrought: that which ye favour, Gods! is famed among mankind.

Sanskit Text: स वाज्य अर्वा स रषिर वचस्यया स शूरो अस्ता पर्तनासु दुष्टरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vājy arvā sa ṛṣir vacasyayā sa śūro astā pṛtanāsu duṣṭaraḥ |
Translation: 6 Strong is the steed, the man a sage in eloquence, the bowman is a hero hard to beat in fight,

Sanskit Text: स रायस पोषं स सुवीर्यं दधे यं वाजो विभ्वां रभवो यम आविषुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa rāyas poṣaṃ sa suvīryaṃ dadhe yaṃ vājo vibhvāṃ ṛbhavo yam āviṣuḥ ||
Translation: Great store of wealth and manly power hath he obtained whom Vāja, Vibhvan, Ṛbhus have looked kindly on.

Sanskit Text: शरेष्ठं वः पेशो अधि धायि दर्शतं सतोमो वाजा रभवस तं जुजुष्टन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śreṣṭhaṃ vaḥ peśo adhi dhāyi darśataṃ stomo vājā ṛbhavas taṃ jujuṣṭana |
Translation: 7 To you hath been assigned the fairest ornament, the hymn of praise: Vājas and Ṛbhus, joy therein;

Sanskit Text: धीरासो हि षठा कवयो विपश्चितस तान व एना बरह्मणा वेदयामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhīrāso hi ṣṭhā kavayo vipaścitas tān va enā brahmaṇā vedayāmasi ||
Translation: For ye have lore and wisdom and poetic skill: as such, with this our prayer we call on you to come.

Sanskit Text: यूयम अस्मभ्यं धिषणाभ्यस परि विद्वांसो विश्वा नर्याणि भोजना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyam asmabhyaṃ dhiṣaṇābhyas pari vidvāṃso viśvā naryāṇi bhojanā |
Translation: 8 According to the wishes of our hearts may ye, who have full knowledge of all the delights of men,

Sanskit Text: दयुमन्तं वाजं वर्षशुष्मम उत्तमम आ नो रयिम रभवस तक्षता वयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyumantaṃ vājaṃ vṛṣaśuṣmam uttamam ā no rayim ṛbhavas takṣatā vayaḥ ||
Translation: Fashion for us, O Ṛbhus, power and splendid wealth, rich in high courage, excellent, and vital strength.

Sanskit Text: इह परजाम इह रयिं रराणा इह शरवो वीरवत तक्षता नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iha prajām iha rayiṃ rarāṇā iha śravo vīravat takṣatā naḥ |
Translation: 9 Bestowing on us here riches and offspring, here fashion fame for us befitting heroes.

Sanskit Text: येन वयं चितयेमात्य अन्यान तं वाजं चित्रम रभवो ददा नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena vayaṃ citayemāty anyān taṃ vājaṃ citram ṛbhavo dadā naḥ ||
Translation: Vouchsafe us wealth of splendid sort, O Ṛbhus, that we may make us more renowned than others.

Sanskit Text: उप नो वाजा अध्वरम रभुक्षा देवा यात पथिभिर देवयानैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa no vājā adhvaram ṛbhukṣā devā yāta pathibhir devayānaiḥ |
Translation: 1. COME to our sacrifice, Vājas, Ṛbhukṣans, Gods, by the paths which Gods are wont to travel,

Sanskit Text: यथा यज्ञम मनुषो विक्ष्व आसु दधिध्वे रण्वाः सुदिनेष्व अह्नाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā yajñam manuṣo vikṣv āsu dadhidhve raṇvāḥ sudineṣv ahnām ||
Translation: As ye, gay Gods, accept in splendid weather the sacrifice among these folk of Manus.

Sanskit Text: ते वो हर्दे मनसे सन्तु यज्ञा जुष्टासो अद्य घर्तनिर्णिजो गुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te vo hṛde manase santu yajñā juṣṭāso adya ghṛtanirṇijo ghuḥ |
Translation: 2 May these rites please you in your heart and spirit; may the drops clothed in oil this day approach you.

Sanskit Text: पर वः सुतासो हरयन्त पूर्णाः करत्वे दक्षाय हर्षयन्त पीताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vaḥ sutāso harayanta pūrṇāḥ kratve dakṣāya harṣayanta pītāḥ ||
Translation: May the abundant juices bear you onward to power and strength, and, when imbibed, delight you.

Sanskit Text: तर्युदायं देवहितं यथा व सतोमो वाजा रभुक्षणो ददे वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tryudāyaṃ devahitaṃ yathā va stomo vājā ṛbhukṣaṇo dade vaḥ |
Translation: 3 Your threefold going near is God-appointed, so praise is given you, Vājas and Ṛbhukṣans.

Sanskit Text: जुह्वे मनुष्वद उपरासु विक्षु युष्मे सचा बर्हद्दिवेषु सोमम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: juhve manuṣvad uparāsu vikṣu yuṣme sacā bṛhaddiveṣu somam ||
Translation: So, Manus-like, mid younger folk I offer, to you who are aloft in heaven, the Soma.

Sanskit Text: पीवोश्वाः शुचद्रथा हि भूतायःशिप्रा वाजिनः सुनिष्काः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pīvoaśvāḥ śucadrathā hi bhūtāyaḥśiprā vājinaḥ suniṣkāḥ |
Translation: 4 Strong, with fair chains of gold and jaws of iron, ye have a splendid car and well-fed horses.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य सूनो शवसो नपातो ऽनु वश चेत्य अग्रियम मदाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya sūno śavaso napāto 'nu vaś cety aghriyam madāya ||
Translation: Ye Sons of Strength, ye progeny of Indra, to you the best is offered to delight you.

Sanskit Text: रभुम रभुक्षणो रयिं वाजे वाजिन्तमं युजम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛbhum ṛbhukṣaṇo rayiṃ vāje vājintamaṃ yujam |
Translation: 5 Ṛbhukṣans! him, for handy wealth, the mightiest comrade in the fight,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्वन्तं हवामहे सदासातमम अश्विनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasvantaṃ havāmahe sadāsātamam aśvinam ||
Translation: Him, Indra's equal, we invoke, most bounteous ever, rich in steeds.

Sanskit Text: सेद रभवो यम अवथ यूयम इन्द्रश च मर्त्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sed ṛbhavo yam avatha yūyam indraś ca martyam |
Translation: 6 The mortal man whom, Ṛbhus, ye and Indra favour with your help,

Sanskit Text: स धीभिर अस्तु सनिता मेधसाता सो अर्वता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa dhībhir astu sanitā medhasātā so arvatā ||
Translation: Must be successful, by his thoughts, at sacrifice and with the steed.

Sanskit Text: वि नो वाजा रभुक्षणः पथश चितन यष्टवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi no vājā ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ pathaś citana yaṣṭave |
Translation: 7 O Vājas and Ṛbhukṣans, free for us the paths to sacrifice,

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं सूरय सतुता विश्वा आशास तरीषणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ sūraya stutā viśvā āśās tarīṣaṇi ||
Translation: Ye Princes, lauded, that we may press forward to each point of heaven.

Sanskit Text: तं नो वाजा रभुक्षण इन्द्र नासत्या रयिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ no vājā ṛbhukṣaṇa indra nāsatyā rayim |
Translation: 8 O Vājas and Ṛbhukṣans, ye Nāsatyas, Indra, bless this wealth,

Sanskit Text: सम अश्वं चर्षणिभ्य आ पुरु शस्त मघत्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sam aśvaṃ carṣaṇibhya ā puru śasta maghattaye ||
Translation: And, before other men's, the steed, that ample riches may be won.

Sanskit Text: उतो हि वां दात्रा सन्ति पूर्वा या पूरुभ्यस तरसदस्युर नितोशे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto hi vāṃ dātrā santi pūrvā yā pūrubhyas trasadasyur nitośe |
Translation: 1. FROM you two came the gifts in days aforetime which Trasadasyu granted to the Pūrus.

Sanskit Text: कषेत्रासां ददथुर उर्वरासां घनं दस्युभ्यो अभिभूतिम उग्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣetrāsāṃ dadathur urvarāsāṃ ghanaṃ dasyubhyo abhibhūtim ughram ||
Translation: Ye gave the winner of our fields and plough-lands, and the strong smiter who subdued the Dasyus.

Sanskit Text: उत वाजिनम पुरुनिष्षिध्वानं दधिक्राम उ ददथुर विश्वक्र्ष्टिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta vājinam puruniṣṣidhvānaṃ dadhikrām u dadathur viśvakṛṣṭim |
Translation: 2 And ye gave mighty Dadhikrās, the giver of many gifts, who visiteth all people,

Sanskit Text: रजिप्यं शयेनम परुषितप्सुम आशुं चर्क्र्त्यम अर्यो नर्पतिं न शूरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛjipyaṃ śyenam pruṣitapsum āśuṃ carkṛtyam aryo nṛpatiṃ na śūram ||
Translation: Impetuous hawk, swift and of varied colour, like a brave King whom each true man must honour.

Sanskit Text: यं सीम अनु परवतेव दरवन्तं विश्वः पूरुर मदति हर्षमाणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ sīm anu pravateva dravantaṃ viśvaḥ pūrur madati harṣamāṇaḥ |
Translation: 3 Whom, as ’twere down a precipice, swift rushing, each Pūru praises and his heart rejoices,—

Sanskit Text: पड्भिर गर्ध्यन्तम मेधयुं न शूरं रथतुरं वातम इव धरजन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: paḍbhir ghṛdhyantam medhayuṃ na śūraṃ rathaturaṃ vātam iva dhrajantam ||
Translation: Springing forth like a hero fain for battle, whirling the car and flying like the tempest.

Sanskit Text: यः समारुन्धानो गध्या समत्सु सनुतरश चरति गोषु गछन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ smārundhāno ghadhyā samatsu sanutaraś carati ghoṣu ghachan |
Translation: 4 Who gaineth precious booty in the combats and moveth, winning spoil, among the cattle;

Sanskit Text: आविर्र्जीको विदथा निचिक्यत तिरो अरतिम पर्य आप आयोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvirṛjīko vidathā nicikyat tiro aratim pary āpa āyoḥ ||
Translation: Shown in bright colour, looking on the assemblies, beyond the churl, to worship of the living.

Sanskit Text: उत समैनं वस्त्रमथिं न तायुम अनु करोशन्ति कषितयो भरेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta smainaṃ vastramathiṃ na tāyum anu krośanti kṣitayo bhareṣu |
Translation: 5 Loudly the folk cry after him in battles, as ’twere a thief who steals away a garment;

Sanskit Text: नीचायमानं जसुरिं न शयेनं शरवश चाछा पशुमच च यूथम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nīcāyamānaṃ jasuriṃ na śyenaṃ śravaś cāchā paśumac ca yūtham ||
Translation: Speeding to glory, or a herd of cattle, even as a hungry falcon swooping downward.

Sanskit Text: उत समासु परथमः सरिष्यन नि वेवेति शरेणिभी रथानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta smāsu prathamaḥ sariṣyan ni veveti śreṇibhī rathānām |
Translation: 6 And, fain to come forth first amid these armies, this way and that with rows of cars he rushes,

Sanskit Text: सरजं कर्ण्वानो जन्यो न शुभ्वा रेणुं रेरिहत किरणं ददश्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: srajaṃ kṛṇvāno janyo na śubhvā reṇuṃ rerihat kiraṇaṃ dadaśvān ||
Translation: Gay like a bridesman, making him a garland, tossing the dust, champing the rein that holds him.

Sanskit Text: उत सय वाजी सहुरिर रतावा शुश्रूषमाणस तन्वा समर्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta sya vājī sahurir ṛtāvā śuśrūṣamāṇas tanvā samarye |
Translation: 7 And that strong Steed, victorious and faithful, obedient with his body in the combat,

Sanskit Text: तुरं यतीषु तुरयन्न रजिप्यो ऽधि भरुवोः किरते रेणुम रञ्जन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: turaṃ yatīṣu turayann ṛjipyo 'dhi bhruvoḥ kirate reṇum ṛñjan ||
Translation: Speeding straight on amid the swiftly pressing, casts o’er his brows the dust he tosses upward.

Sanskit Text: उत समास्य तन्यतोर इव दयोर रघायतो अभियुजो भयन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta smāsya tanyator iva dyor ṛghāyato abhiyujo bhayante |
Translation: 8 And at his thunder, like the roar of heaven, those who attack tremble and are affrighted;

Sanskit Text: यदा सहस्रम अभि षीम अयोधीद दुर्वर्तुः समा भवति भीम रञ्जन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā sahasram abhi ṣīm ayodhīd durvartuḥ smā bhavati bhīma ṛñjan ||
Translation: For when he fights against embattled thousands, dread is he in his striving; none may stay him.

Sanskit Text: उत समास्य पनयन्ति जना जूतिं कर्ष्टिप्रो अभिभूतिम आशोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta smāsya panayanti janā jūtiṃ kṛṣṭipro abhibhūtim āśoḥ |
Translation: 9 The people praise the overpowering swiftness of this fleet Steed who giveth men abundance.

Sanskit Text: उतैनम आहुः समिथे वियन्तः परा दधिक्रा असरत सहस्रैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utainam āhuḥ samithe viyantaḥ parā dadhikrā asarat sahasraiḥ ||
Translation: Of him they say when drawing back from battle. Dadhikrās hath sped forward with his thousands.

Sanskit Text: आ दधिक्राः शवसा पञ्च कर्ष्टीः सूर्य इव जयोतिषापस ततान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā dadhikrāḥ śavasā pañca kṛṣṭīḥ sūrya iva jyotiṣāpas tatāna |
Translation: 10 Dadhikrās hath o’erspread the Fivefold People with vigour, as the Sun lightens the waters.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रसाः शतसा वाज्य अर्वा पर्णक्तु मध्वा सम इमा वचांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasrasāḥ śatasā vājy arvā pṛṇaktu madhvā sam imā vacāṃsi ||
Translation: May the strong Steed who winneth hundreds, thousands, requite with sweetness these my words and praises.

Sanskit Text: आशुं दधिक्रां तम उ नु षटवाम दिवस पर्थिव्या उत चर्किराम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āśuṃ dadhikrāṃ tam u nu ṣṭavāma divas pṛthivyā uta carkirāma |
Translation: 1. Now give we praise to Dadhikrās the rapid, and mention in our laud the Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: उछन्तीर माम उषसः सूदयन्त्व अति विश्वानि दुरितानि पर्षन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uchantīr mām uṣasaḥ sūdayantv ati viśvāni duritāni parṣan ||
Translation: May the Dawns flushing move me to exertion, and bear me safely over every trouble.

Sanskit Text: महश चर्कर्म्य अर्वतः करतुप्रा दधिक्राव्णः पुरुवारस्य वर्ष्णः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahaś carkarmy arvataḥ kratuprā dadhikrāvṇaḥ puruvārasya vṛṣṇaḥ |
Translation: 2 I praise the mighty Steed who fills my spirit, the Stallion Dadhikrāvan rich in bounties,

Sanskit Text: यम पूरुभ्यो दीदिवांसं नाग्निं ददथुर मित्रावरुणा ततुरिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yam pūrubhyo dīdivāṃsaṃ nāghniṃ dadathur mitrāvaruṇā taturim ||
Translation: Whom, swift of foot and shining bright as Agni, ye, Varuṇa and Mitra, gave to Pūrus.

Sanskit Text: यो अश्वस्य दधिक्राव्णो अकारीत समिद्धे अग्ना उषसो वयुष्टौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo aśvasya dadhikrāvṇo akārīt samiddhe aghnā uṣaso vyuṣṭau |
Translation: 3 Him who hath honoured, when the flame is kindled at break of dawn, the Courser Dadhikrāvan,

Sanskit Text: अनागसं तम अदितिः कर्णोतु स मित्रेण वरुणेना सजोषाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anāghasaṃ tam aditiḥ kṛṇotu sa mitreṇa varuṇenā sajoṣāḥ ||
Translation: Him, of one mind with Varuṇa and Mitra may Aditi make free from all transgression.

Sanskit Text: दधिक्राव्ण इष ऊर्जो महो यद अमन्महि मरुतां नाम भद्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhikrāvṇa iṣa ūrjo maho yad amanmahi marutāṃ nāma bhadram |
Translation: 4 When we remember mighty Dadhikrāvan our food and strength, then the blest name of Maruts,

Sanskit Text: सवस्तये वरुणम मित्रम अग्निं हवामह इन्द्रं वज्रबाहुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svastaye varuṇam mitram aghniṃ havāmaha indraṃ vajrabāhum ||
Translation: Varuṇa, Mitra, we invoke for welfare, and Agni, and the thunder-wielding Indra.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रम इवेद उभये वि हवयन्त उदीराणा यज्ञम उपप्रयन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indram ived ubhaye vi hvayanta udīrāṇā yajñam upaprayantaḥ |
Translation: 5 Both sides invoke him as they call on Indra when they stir forth and turn to sacrificing.

Sanskit Text: दधिक्राम उ सूदनम मर्त्याय ददथुर मित्रावरुणा नो अश्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhikrām u sūdanam martyāya dadathur mitrāvaruṇā no aśvam ||
Translation: To us have Varuṇa and Mitra granted the Courser Dadhikrās, a guide for mortals.

Sanskit Text: दधिक्राव्णो अकारिषं जिष्णोर अश्वस्य वाजिनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhikrāvṇo akāriṣaṃ jiṣṇor aśvasya vājinaḥ |
Translation: 6 So have I glorified with praise strong Dadhikrāvan, conquering Steed.

Sanskit Text: सुरभि नो मुखा करत पर ण आयूंषि तारिषत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: surabhi no mukhā karat pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tāriṣat ||
Translation: Sweet may he make our mouths; may he prolong the days we have to live.

Sanskit Text: दधिक्राव्ण इद उ नु चर्किराम विश्वा इन माम उषसः सूदयन्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhikrāvṇa id u nu carkirāma viśvā in mām uṣasaḥ sūdayantu |
Translation: 1. LET us recite the praise of Dadhikrāvan: may all the Mornings move me to exertion;

Sanskit Text: अपाम अग्नेर उषसः सूर्यस्य बर्हस्पतेर आङगिरसस्य जिष्णोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apām aghner uṣasaḥ sūryasya bṛhaspater āṅghirasasya jiṣṇoḥ ||
Translation: Praise of the Lord of Waters, Dawn, and Agni, Bṛhaspati Son of Aṅgiras, and Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: सत्वा भरिषो गविषो दुवन्यसच छरवस्याद इष उषसस तुरण्यसत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satvā bhariṣo ghaviṣo duvanyasac chravasyād iṣa uṣasas turaṇyasat |
Translation: 2 Brave, seeking war and booty, dwelling with the good and with the swift, may he hasten the food of Dawn.

Sanskit Text: सत्यो दरवो दरवरः पतंगरो दधिक्रावेषम ऊर्जं सवर जनत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satyo dravo dravaraḥ pataṃgharo dadhikrāveṣam ūrjaṃ svar janat ||
Translation: May he the true, the fleet, the lover of the course, the bird-like Dadhikrāvan, bring food, strength, and light.

Sanskit Text: उत समास्य दरवतस तुरण्यतः पर्णं न वेर अनु वाति परगर्धिनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta smāsya dravatas turaṇyataḥ parṇaṃ na ver anu vāti praghardhinaḥ |
Translation: 3 His pinion, rapid runner, fans him m his way, as of a bird that hastens onward to its aim,

Sanskit Text: शयेनस्येव धरजतो अङकसम परि दधिक्राव्णः सहोर्जा तरित्रतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śyenasyeva dhrajato aṅkasam pari dadhikrāvṇaḥ sahorjā taritrataḥ ||
Translation: And, as it were a falcon's gliding through the air, strikes Dadhikrāvan's side as he speeds on with might.

Sanskit Text: उत सय वाजी कषिपणिं तुरण्यति गरीवायाम बद्धो अपिकक्ष आसनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta sya vājī kṣipaṇiṃ turaṇyati ghrīvāyām baddho apikakṣa āsani |
Translation: 4 Bound by the neck and by the flanks and by the mouth, the vigorous Courser lends new swiftness to his speed.

Sanskit Text: करतुं दधिक्रा अनु संतवीत्वत पथाम अङकांस्य अन्व आपनीफणत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratuṃ dadhikrā anu saṃtavītvat pathām aṅkāṃsy anv āpanīphaṇat ||
Translation: Drawing himself together, as his strength allows, Dadhikrās springs along the windings of the paths.

Sanskit Text: हंसः शुचिषद वसुर अन्तरिक्षसद धोता वेदिषद अतिथिर दुरोणसत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: haṃsaḥ śuciṣad vasur antarikṣasad dhotā vediṣad atithir duroṇasat |
Translation: 5 The Haṁsa homed in light, the Vasu in mid-air, the priest beside the altar, in the house the guest,

Sanskit Text: नर्षद वरसद रतसद वयोमसद अब्जा गोजा रतजा अद्रिजा रतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛṣad varasad ṛtasad vyomasad abjā ghojā ṛtajā adrijā ṛtam ||
Translation: Dweller in noblest place, mid men, in truth, in sky, born of flood, kine, truth, mountain, he is holy Law.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रा को वां वरुणा सुम्नम आप सतोमो हविष्मां अम्र्तो न होता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrā ko vāṃ varuṇā sumnam āpa stomo haviṣmāṃ amṛto na hotā |
Translation: 1. WHAT laud, O Indra-Varuṇa, with oblation, hath like the Immortal Priest obtained your favour?

Sanskit Text: यो वां हर्दि करतुमां अस्मद उक्तः पस्पर्शद इन्द्रावरुणा नमस्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vāṃ hṛdi kratumāṃ asmad uktaḥ pasparśad indrāvaruṇā namasvān ||
Translation: Hath our effectual laud, addressed with homage, touched you, O Indra-Varuṇa, in spirit?

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रा ह यो वरुणा चक्र आपी देवौ मर्तः सख्याय परयस्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrā ha yo varuṇā cakra āpī devau martaḥ sakhyāya prayasvān |
Translation: 2 He who with dainty food hath won you, Indra and Varuṇa, Gods, as his allies to friendship,

Sanskit Text: स हन्ति वर्त्रा समिथेषु शत्रून अवोभिर वा महद्भिः स पर शर्ण्वे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hanti vṛtrā samitheṣu śatrūn avobhir vā mahadbhiḥ sa pra śṛṇve ||
Translation: Slayeth the Vṛtras and his foes in battles, and through your mighty favours is made famous.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रा ह रत्नं वरुणा धेष्ठेत्था नर्भ्यः शशमानेभ्यस ता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrā ha ratnaṃ varuṇā dheṣṭhetthā nṛbhyaḥ śaśamānebhyas tā |
Translation: 3 Indra and Varuṇa are most liberal givers of treasure to the men who toil to serve them,

Sanskit Text: यदी सखाया सख्याय सोमैः सुतेभिः सुप्रयसा मादयैते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadī sakhāyā sakhyāya somaiḥ sutebhiḥ suprayasā mādayaite ||
Translation: When they, as Friends inclined to friendship, honoured with dainty food, delight in flowing Soma.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रा युवं वरुणा दिद्युम अस्मिन्न ओजिष्ठम उग्रा नि वधिष्टं वज्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrā yuvaṃ varuṇā didyum asminn ojiṣṭham ughrā ni vadhiṣṭaṃ vajram |
Translation: 4 Indra and Varuṇa, ye hurl, O Mighty, on him your strongest flashing bolt of thunder

Sanskit Text: यो नो दुरेवो वर्कतिर दभीतिस तस्मिन मिमाथाम अभिभूत्य ओजः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo no durevo vṛkatir dabhītis tasmin mimāthām abhibhūty ojaḥ ||
Translation: Who treats us ill, the robber and oppressor: measure on him your overwhelming vigour.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रा युवं वरुणा भूतम अस्या धियः परेतारा वर्षभेव धेनोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrā yuvaṃ varuṇā bhūtam asyā dhiyaḥ pretārā vṛṣabheva dhenoḥ |
Translation: 5 O Indra-Varuṇa, be ye the lovers of this my song, as steers who love the milch-Cow.

Sanskit Text: सा नो दुहीयद यवसेव गत्वी सहस्रधारा पयसा मही गौः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā no duhīyad yavaseva ghatvī sahasradhārā payasā mahī ghauḥ ||
Translation: Milk may it yield us as, gone forth to pasture, the great Cow pouring out her thousand rivers.

Sanskit Text: तोके हिते तनय उर्वरासु सूरो दर्शीके वर्षणश च पौंस्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: toke hite tanaya urvarāsu sūro dṛśīke vṛṣaṇaś ca pauṃsye |
Translation: 6 For fertile fields, for worthy sons and grandsons, for the Sun's beauty and for steer-like vigour,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रा नो अत्र वरुणा सयाताम अवोभिर दस्मा परितक्म्यायाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrā no atra varuṇā syātām avobhir dasmā paritakmyāyām ||
Translation: May Indra-Varuṇa with gracious favours work marvels for us in the stress of battle.

Sanskit Text: युवाम इद धय अवसे पूर्व्याय परि परभूती गविषः सवापी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvām id dhy avase pūrvyāya pari prabhūtī ghaviṣaḥ svāpī |
Translation: 7 For you, as Princes, for your ancient kindness, good comrades of the man who seeks for booty,

Sanskit Text: वर्णीमहे सख्याय परियाय शूरा मंहिष्ठा पितरेव शम्भू ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṇīmahe sakhyāya priyāya śūrā maṃhiṣṭhā pitareva śambhū ||
Translation: We choose to us for the dear bond of friendship, most liberal Heroes bringing bliss like parents.

Sanskit Text: ता वां धियो ऽवसे वाजयन्तीर आजिं न जग्मुर युवयूः सुदानू |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā vāṃ dhiyo 'vase vājayantīr ājiṃ na jaghmur yuvayūḥ sudānū |
Translation: 8 Showing their strength, these hymns for grace, Free-givers I have gone to you, devoted, as to battle.

Sanskit Text: शरिये न गाव उप सोमम अस्थुर इन्द्रं गिरो वरुणम मे मनीषाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śriye na ghāva upa somam asthur indraṃ ghiro varuṇam me manīṣāḥ ||
Translation: For glory have they gone, as milk to Soma, to Indra-Varuṇa my thoughts and praises.

Sanskit Text: इमा इन्द्रं वरुणम मे मनीषा अग्मन्न उप दरविणम इछमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā indraṃ varuṇam me manīṣā aghmann upa draviṇam ichamānāḥ |
Translation: 9 To Indra and to Varuṇa, desirous of gaining wealth have these my thoughts proceeded.

Sanskit Text: उपेम अस्थुर जोष्टार इव वस्वो रघ्वीर इव शरवसो भिक्षमाणाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upem asthur joṣṭāra iva vasvo raghvīr iva śravaso bhikṣamāṇāḥ ||
Translation: They have come nigh to you as treasure-lovers, like mares, fleet-footed, eager for the glory.

Sanskit Text: अश्व्यस्य तमना रथ्यस्य पुष्टेर नित्यस्य रायः पतयः सयाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvyasya tmanā rathyasya puṣṭer nityasya rāyaḥ patayaḥ syāma |
Translation: 10 May we ourselves be lords of during riches, of ample sustenance for car and hones.

Sanskit Text: ता चक्राणा ऊतिभिर नव्यसीभिर अस्मत्रा रायो नियुतः सचन्ताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā cakrāṇā ūtibhir navyasībhir asmatrā rāyo niyutaḥ sacantām ||
Translation: So may the Twain who work with newest succours bring yoked teams hitherward to us and riches.

Sanskit Text: आ नो बर्हन्ता बर्हतीभिर ऊती इन्द्र यातं वरुण वाजसातौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no bṛhantā bṛhatībhir ūtī indra yātaṃ varuṇa vājasātau |
Translation: 11 Come with your mighty succours, O ye Mighty; come, Indra-Varuṇa, to us in battle.

Sanskit Text: यद दिद्यवः पर्तनासु परक्रीळान तस्य वां सयाम सनितार आजेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad didyavaḥ pṛtanāsu prakrīḷān tasya vāṃ syāma sanitāra ājeḥ ||
Translation: What time the flashing arrows play in combat, may we through you be winners in the contest.

Sanskit Text: मम दविता राष्ट्रं कषत्रियस्य विश्वायोर विश्वे अम्र्ता यथा नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mama dvitā rāṣṭraṃ kṣatriyasya viśvāyor viśve amṛtā yathā naḥ |
Translation: 1. I AM the royal Ruler, mine is empire, as mine who sway all life are all Immortals.

Sanskit Text: करतुं सचन्ते वरुणस्य देवा राजामि कर्ष्टेर उपमस्य वव्रेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratuṃ sacante varuṇasya devā rājāmi kṛṣṭer upamasya vavreḥ ||
Translation: Varuṇa's will the Gods obey and follow. I am the King of men's most lofty cover.

Sanskit Text: अहं राजा वरुणो मह्यं तान्य असुर्याणि परथमा धारयन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ rājā varuṇo mahyaṃ tāny asuryāṇi prathamā dhārayanta |
Translation: 2 I am King Varuṇa. To me were given these first existing high celestial powers.

Sanskit Text: करतुं सचन्ते वरुणस्य देवा राजामि कर्ष्टेर उपमस्य वव्रेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratuṃ sacante varuṇasya devā rājāmi kṛṣṭer upamasya vavreḥ ||
Translation: Varuṇa's will the Gods obey and follow. I am the King of men's most lofty cover.

Sanskit Text: अहम इन्द्रो वरुणस ते महित्वोर्वी गभीरे रजसी सुमेके |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aham indro varuṇas te mahitvorvī ghabhīre rajasī sumeke |
Translation: 3 I Varuṇa am Indra: in their greatness, these the two wide deep fairly-fashioned regions,

Sanskit Text: तवष्टेव विश्वा भुवनानि विद्वान सम ऐरयं रोदसी धारयं च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṣṭeva viśvā bhuvanāni vidvān sam airayaṃ rodasī dhārayaṃ ca ||
Translation: These the two world-halves have I, even as Tvaṣṭar knowing all beings, joined and held together.

Sanskit Text: अहम अपो अपिन्वम उक्षमाणा धारयं दिवं सदन रतस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aham apo apinvam ukṣamāṇā dhārayaṃ divaṃ sadana ṛtasya |
Translation: 4 I made to flow the moisture-shedding waters, and set the heaven firm in the scat of Order.

Sanskit Text: रतेन पुत्रो अदितेर रतावोत तरिधातु परथयद वि भूम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtena putro aditer ṛtāvota tridhātu prathayad vi bhūma ||
Translation: By Law the Son of Aditi, Law Observer, hath spread abroad the world in threefold measure.

Sanskit Text: मां नरः सवश्वा वाजयन्तो मां वर्ताः समरणे हवन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: māṃ naraḥ svaśvā vājayanto māṃ vṛtāḥ samaraṇe havante |
Translation: 5 Heroes with noble horses, fain for battle, selected warriors, call on me in combat.

Sanskit Text: कर्णोम्य आजिम मघवाहम इन्द्र इयर्मि रेणुम अभिभूत्योजाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṇomy ājim maghavāham indra iyarmi reṇum abhibhūtyojāḥ ||
Translation: I Indra Maghavan, excite the conflict; I stir the dust, Lord of surpassing vigour.
