Sanskit Text: अहं ता विश्वा चकरं नकिर मा दैव्यं सहो वरते अप्रतीतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ tā viśvā cakaraṃ nakir mā daivyaṃ saho varate apratītam |
Translation: 6 All this I did. The Gods’ own conquering power never impedeth me whom none opposeth.

Sanskit Text: यन मा सोमासो ममदन यद उक्थोभे भयेते रजसी अपारे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yan mā somāso mamadan yad ukthobhe bhayete rajasī apāre ||
Translation: When lauds and Soma juice have made me joyful, both the unbounded regions are affrighted.

Sanskit Text: विदुष ते विश्वा भुवनानि तस्य ता पर बरवीषि वरुणाय वेधः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viduṣ te viśvā bhuvanāni tasya tā pra bravīṣi varuṇāya vedhaḥ |
Translation: 7 All beings know these deeds of thine thou tellest this unto Varuṇa, thou great Disposer!

Sanskit Text: तवं वर्त्राणि शर्ण्विषे जघन्वान तवं वर्तां अरिणा इन्द्र सिन्धून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ vṛtrāṇi śṛṇviṣe jaghanvān tvaṃ vṛtāṃ ariṇā indra sindhūn ||
Translation: Thou art renowned as having slain the Vṛtras. Thou madest flow the floods that were obstructed.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकम अत्र पितरस त आसन सप्त रषयो दौर्गहे बध्यमाने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākam atra pitaras ta āsan sapta ṛṣayo daurghahe badhyamāne |
Translation: 8 Our fathers then were these, the Seven his, what time the son of Durgaha was captive.

Sanskit Text: त आयजन्त तरसदस्युम अस्या इन्द्रं न वर्त्रतुरम अर्धदेवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta āyajanta trasadasyum asyā indraṃ na vṛtraturam ardhadevam ||
Translation: For her they gained by sacrifice Trasadasyu, a demi-god, like Indra, conquering foemen.

Sanskit Text: पुरुकुत्सानी हि वाम अदाशद धव्येभिर इन्द्रावरुणा नमोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purukutsānī hi vām adāśad dhavyebhir indrāvaruṇā namobhiḥ |
Translation: 9 The spouse of Purukutsa gave oblations to you, O Indra-Varuṇa, with homage.

Sanskit Text: अथा राजानं तरसदस्युम अस्या वर्त्रहणं ददथुर अर्धदेवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā rājānaṃ trasadasyum asyā vṛtrahaṇaṃ dadathur ardhadevam ||
Translation: Then unto her ye gave King Trasadasyu, the demi-god, the slayer of the foeman.

Sanskit Text: राया वयं ससवांसो मदेम हव्येन देवा यवसेन गावः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyā vayaṃ sasavāṃso madema havyena devā yavasena ghāvaḥ |
Translation: 10 May we, possessing much, delight in riches, Gods in oblations and the kine in pasture;

Sanskit Text: तां धेनुम इन्द्रावरुणा युवं नो विश्वाहा धत्तम अनपस्फुरन्तीम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāṃ dhenum indrāvaruṇā yuvaṃ no viśvāhā dhattam anapasphurantīm ||
Translation: And that Milch-cow who shrinks not from the milking, O Indra-Varuṇa, give to us daily.

Sanskit Text: तं वां रथं वयम अद्या हुवेम पर्थुज्रयम अश्विना संगतिं गोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vāṃ rathaṃ vayam adyā huvema pṛthujrayam aśvinā saṃghatiṃ ghoḥ |
Translation: 1. WE will invoke this day your car, far-spreading, O Aśvins, even the gathering, of the sunlight,—

Sanskit Text: यः सूर्यां वहति वन्धुरायुर गिर्वाहसम पुरुतमं वसूयुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ sūryāṃ vahati vandhurāyur ghirvāhasam purutamaṃ vasūyum ||
Translation: Car praised in hymns, most ample, rich in treasure, fitted with seats, the car that beareth Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: युवं शरियम अश्विना देवता तां दिवो नपाता वनथः शचीभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ śriyam aśvinā devatā tāṃ divo napātā vanathaḥ śacībhiḥ |
Translation: 2 Aśvins, ye gained that glory by your Godhead, ye Sons of Heaven, by your own might and power.

Sanskit Text: युवोर वपुर अभि पर्क्षः सचन्ते वहन्ति यत ककुहासो रथे वाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvor vapur abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante vahanti yat kakuhāso rathe vām ||
Translation: Food followeth close upon your bright appearing when stately horses in your chariot draw you.

Sanskit Text: को वाम अद्या करते रातहव्य ऊतये वा सुतपेयाय वार्कैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko vām adyā karate rātahavya ūtaye vā sutapeyāya vārkaiḥ |
Translation: 3 Who bringeth you to-day for help with offered oblation, or with hymns to drink the juices?

Sanskit Text: रतस्य वा वनुषे पूर्व्याय नमो येमानो अश्विना ववर्तत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya vā vanuṣe pūrvyāya namo yemāno aśvinā vavartat ||
Translation: Who, for the sacrifice's ancient lover, turneth you hither, Aśvins, offering homage?

Sanskit Text: हिरण्ययेन पुरुभू रथेनेमं यज्ञं नासत्योप यातम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyayena purubhū rathenemaṃ yajñaṃ nāsatyopa yātam |
Translation: 4 Borne on your golden car, ye omnipresent! come to this sacrifice of ours, Nāsatyas.

Sanskit Text: पिबाथ इन मधुनः सोम्यस्य दधथो रत्नं विधते जनाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibātha in madhunaḥ somyasya dadhatho ratnaṃ vidhate janāya ||
Translation: Drink of the pleasant liquor of the Soma give riches to the people who adore you.

Sanskit Text: आ नो यातं दिवो अछा पर्थिव्या हिरण्ययेन सुव्र्ता रथेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no yātaṃ divo achā pṛthivyā hiraṇyayena suvṛtā rathena |
Translation: 5 Come hitherward to us from earth, from heaven, borne on your golden chariot rolling lightly.

Sanskit Text: मा वाम अन्ये नि यमन देवयन्तः सं यद ददे नाभिः पूर्व्या वाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā vām anye ni yaman devayantaḥ saṃ yad dade nābhiḥ pūrvyā vām ||
Translation: Suffer not other worshippers to stay you here are ye bound by earlier bonds of friendship.

Sanskit Text: नू नो रयिम पुरुवीरम बर्हन्तं दस्रा मिमाथाम उभयेष्व अस्मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū no rayim puruvīram bṛhantaṃ dasrā mimāthām ubhayeṣv asme |
Translation: 6 Now for us both, mete out, O Wonder-Workers, riches exceeding great with store of heroes,

Sanskit Text: नरो यद वाम अश्विना सतोमम आवन सधस्तुतिम आजमीळ्हासो अग्मन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: naro yad vām aśvinā stomam āvan sadhastutim ājamīḷhāso aghman ||
Translation: Because the men have sent you praise, O Aśvins, and Ajamīlhas come to the laudation.

Sanskit Text: इहेह यद वां समना पप्र्क्षे सेयम अस्मे सुमतिर वाजरत्ना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iheha yad vāṃ samanā papṛkṣe seyam asme sumatir vājaratnā |
Translation: 7 Whene’er I gratified you here together, your grace was given us, O ye rich in booty.

Sanskit Text: उरुष्यतं जरितारं युवं ह शरितः कामो नासत्या युवद्रिक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uruṣyataṃ jaritāraṃ yuvaṃ ha śritaḥ kāmo nāsatyā yuvadrik ||
Translation: Protect, ye Twain, the singer of your praises: to you, Nāsatyas, is my wish directed.

Sanskit Text: एष सय भानुर उद इयर्ति युज्यते रथः परिज्मा दिवो अस्य सानवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa sya bhānur ud iyarti yujyate rathaḥ parijmā divo asya sānavi |
Translation: 1. YONDER goes up that light: your chariot is yoked that travels round upon the summit of this heaven.

Sanskit Text: पर्क्षासो अस्मिन मिथुना अधि तरयो दर्तिस तुरीयो मधुनो वि रप्शते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛkṣāso asmin mithunā adhi trayo dṛtis turīyo madhuno vi rapśate ||
Translation: Within this car are stored three kindred shares of food, and a skin filled with meath is rustling as the fourth.

Sanskit Text: उद वाम पर्क्षासो मधुमन्त ईरते रथा अश्वास उषसो वयुष्टिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud vām pṛkṣāso madhumanta īrate rathā aśvāsa uṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu |
Translation: 2 Forth come your viands rich with store of pleasant meath, and cars and horses at the flushing of the dawn,

Sanskit Text: अपोर्णुवन्तस तम आ परीव्र्तं सवर ण शुक्रं तन्वन्त आ रजः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aporṇuvantas tama ā parīvṛtaṃ svar ṇa śukraṃ tanvanta ā rajaḥ ||
Translation: Stripping the covering from the surrounded gloom, and spreading through mid-air bright radiance like the Sun.

Sanskit Text: मध्वः पिबतम मधुपेभिर आसभिर उत परियम मधुने युञ्जाथां रथम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhvaḥ pibatam madhupebhir āsabhir uta priyam madhune yuñjāthāṃ ratham |
Translation: 3 Drink of the meath with lips accustomed to the draught; harness for the meath's sake the chariot that ye love.

Sanskit Text: आ वर्तनिम मधुना जिन्वथस पथो दर्तिं वहेथे मधुमन्तम अश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vartanim madhunā jinvathas patho dṛtiṃ vahethe madhumantam aśvinā ||
Translation: Refresh the way ye go, refresh the paths with meath: hither, O Aśvins, bring the skin that holds the meath.

Sanskit Text: हंसासो ये वाम मधुमन्तो अस्रिधो हिरण्यपर्णा उहुव उषर्बुधः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: haṃsāso ye vām madhumanto asridho hiraṇyaparṇā uhuva uṣarbudhaḥ |
Translation: 4 The swans ye have are friendly, rich in store of meath, gold-pinioned, strong to draw, awake at early morn,

Sanskit Text: उदप्रुतो मन्दिनो मन्दिनिस्प्र्शो मध्वो न मक्षः सवनानि गछथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: udapruto mandino mandinispṛśo madhvo na makṣaḥ savanāni ghachathaḥ ||
Translation: Swimming the flood, exultant, fain for draughts that cheer: ye come like flies to our libations of the meath.

Sanskit Text: सवध्वरासो मधुमन्तो अग्नय उस्रा जरन्ते परति वस्तोर अश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svadhvarāso madhumanto aghnaya usrā jarante prati vastor aśvinā |
Translation: 5 Well knowing solemn rites and rich in meath, the fires sing to the morning Aśvins at the break of day,

Sanskit Text: यन निक्तहस्तस तरणिर विचक्षणः सोमं सुषाव मधुमन्तम अद्रिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yan niktahastas taraṇir vicakṣaṇaḥ somaṃ suṣāva madhumantam adribhiḥ ||
Translation: When with pure hands the prudent energetic priest hath with the stones pressed out the Soma rich in meath.

Sanskit Text: आकेनिपासो अहभिर दविध्वतः सवर ण शुक्रं तन्वन्त आ रजः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ākenipāso ahabhir davidhvataḥ svar ṇa śukraṃ tanvanta ā rajaḥ |
Translation: 6 The rays advancing nigh, chasing with day the gloom, spread through the firmament bright radiance like the Sun;

Sanskit Text: सूरश चिद अश्वान युयुजान ईयते विश्वां अनु सवधया चेतथस पथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūraś cid aśvān yuyujāna īyate viśvāṃ anu svadhayā cetathas pathaḥ ||
Translation: And the Sun harnessing his horses goeth forth: ye through your Godlike nature let his paths be known.

Sanskit Text: पर वाम अवोचम अश्विना धियंधा रथः सवश्वो अजरो यो अस्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vām avocam aśvinā dhiyaṃdhā rathaḥ svaśvo ajaro yo asti |
Translation: 7 Devout in thought I have declared, O Aśvins, your chariot with good steeds, which lasts for ever,

Sanskit Text: येन सद्यः परि रजांसि याथो हविष्मन्तं तरणिम भोजम अछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena sadyaḥ pari rajāṃsi yātho haviṣmantaṃ taraṇim bhojam acha ||
Translation: Wherewith ye travel swiftly through the regions to the prompt worshipper who brings oblation.

Sanskit Text: अग्रम पिबा मधूनां सुतं वायो दिविष्टिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghram pibā madhūnāṃ sutaṃ vāyo diviṣṭiṣu |
Translation: 1. DRINK the best draught of Soma-juice, O Vāyu, at our holy rites:

Sanskit Text: तवं हि पूर्वपा असि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hi pūrvapā asi ||
Translation: For thou art he who drinketh first.

Sanskit Text: शतेना नो अभिष्टिभिर नियुत्वां इन्द्रसारथिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śatenā no abhiṣṭibhir niyutvāṃ indrasārathiḥ |
Translation: 2 Come, team-drawn, with thy hundred helps, with Indra, seated in the car,

Sanskit Text: वायो सुतस्य तर्म्पतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāyo sutasya tṛmpatam ||
Translation: Vāyu, and drink your fill of juice.

Sanskit Text: आ वां सहस्रं हरय इन्द्रवायू अभि परयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ sahasraṃ haraya indravāyū abhi prayaḥ |
Translation: 3 May steeds a thousand bring you both, Indra. and Vāyu, hitherward

Sanskit Text: वहन्तु सोमपीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vahantu somapītaye ||
Translation: To drink the Soma, to the feast.

Sanskit Text: रथं हिरण्यवन्धुरम इन्द्रवायू सवध्वरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathaṃ hiraṇyavandhuram indravāyū svadhvaram |
Translation: 4 For ye, O Indra-Vāyu, mount the golden-seated car that aids

Sanskit Text: आ हि सथाथो दिविस्प्र्शम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā hi sthātho divispṛśam ||
Translation: The sacrifice, that reaches heaven.

Sanskit Text: रथेन पर्थुपाजसा दाश्वांसम उप गछतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathena pṛthupājasā dāśvāṃsam upa ghachatam |
Translation: 5 On far-refulgent chariot come unto the man who offers gifts:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रवायू इहा गतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indravāyū ihā ghatam ||
Translation: Come, Indra-Vāyu, hitherward.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रवायू अयं सुतस तं देवेभिः सजोषसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indravāyū ayaṃ sutas taṃ devebhiḥ sajoṣasā |
Translation: 6 Here, Indra-Vāyu, is the juice: drink it, accordant with the Gods,

Sanskit Text: पिबतं दाशुषो गर्हे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibataṃ dāśuṣo ghṛhe ||
Translation: Within the giver's dwelling-place.

Sanskit Text: इह परयाणम अस्तु वाम इन्द्रवायू विमोचनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iha prayāṇam astu vām indravāyū vimocanam |
Translation: 7 Hither, O Indra-Vāyu, be your journey here unyoke your steeds,

Sanskit Text: इह वां सोमपीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iha vāṃ somapītaye ||
Translation: Here for your draught of Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: वायो शुक्रो अयामि ते मध्वो अग्रं दिविष्टिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāyo śukro ayāmi te madhvo aghraṃ diviṣṭiṣu |
Translation: 1. Vāyu, the bright is offered thee, best of the meath at holy rites.

Sanskit Text: आ याहि सोमपीतये सपार्हो देव नियुत्वता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yāhi somapītaye spārho deva niyutvatā ||
Translation: Come thou to drink the Soma juice, God, longed-for, on thy team-drawn car.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रश च वायव एषां सोमानाम पीतिम अर्हथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraś ca vāyav eṣāṃ somānām pītim arhathaḥ |
Translation: 2 O Vāyu, thou and Indra are meet drinkers of these Soma-draughts,

Sanskit Text: युवां हि यन्तीन्दवो निम्नम आपो न सध्र्यक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvāṃ hi yantīndavo nimnam āpo na sadhryak ||
Translation: For unto you the drops proceed as waters gather to the vale.

Sanskit Text: वायव इन्द्रश च शुष्मिणा सरथं शवसस पती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāyav indraś ca śuṣmiṇā sarathaṃ śavasas patī |
Translation: 3 O Indra-Vāyu, mighty Twain, speeding together, Lords of Strength,

Sanskit Text: नियुत्वन्ता न ऊतय आ यातं सोमपीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niyutvantā na ūtaya ā yātaṃ somapītaye ||
Translation: Come to our succour with your team, that ye may drink the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: या वां सन्ति पुरुस्प्र्हो नियुतो दाशुषे नरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā vāṃ santi puruspṛho niyuto dāśuṣe narā |
Translation: 4 The longed-for teams which ye possess, O Heroes, for the worshipper,

Sanskit Text: अस्मे ता यज्ञवाहसेन्द्रवायू नि यछतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme tā yajñavāhasendravāyū ni yachatam ||
Translation: Turn to us, Indra-Vāyu, ye to whom the sacrifice is paid.

Sanskit Text: यस तस्तम्भ सहसा वि जमो अन्तान बर्हस्पतिस तरिषधस्थो रवेण |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yas tastambha sahasā vi jmo antān bṛhaspatis triṣadhastho raveṇa |
Translation: 1. Him who with might hath propped earth's ends, who sitteth in threefold seat, Bṛhaspati, with thunder,

Sanskit Text: तम परत्नास रषयो दीध्यानाः पुरो विप्रा दधिरे मन्द्रजिह्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tam pratnāsa ṛṣayo dīdhyānāḥ puro viprā dadhire mandrajihvam ||
Translation: Him of the pleasant tongue have ancient sages, deep-thinking, holy singers, set before them.

Sanskit Text: धुनेतयः सुप्रकेतम मदन्तो बर्हस्पते अभि ये नस ततस्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhunetayaḥ supraketam madanto bṛhaspate abhi ye nas tatasre |
Translation: 2 Wild in their course, in well-marked wise rejoicing were they, Bṛhaspati, who pressed around us.

Sanskit Text: पर्षन्तं सर्प्रम अदब्धम ऊर्वम बर्हस्पते रक्षताद अस्य योनिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛṣantaṃ sṛpram adabdham ūrvam bṛhaspate rakṣatād asya yonim ||
Translation: Preserve Bṛhaspati, the stall uninjured, this company's raining, ever-moving birthplace.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पते या परमा परावद अत आ त रतस्प्र्शो नि षेदुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspate yā paramā parāvad ata ā ta ṛtaspṛśo ni ṣeduḥ |
Translation: 3 Bṛhaspati, from thy remotest distance have they sat down who love the law eternal.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्यं खाता अवता अद्रिदुग्धा मध्व शचोतन्त्य अभितो विरप्शम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyaṃ khātā avatā adridughdhā madhva ścotanty abhito virapśam ||
Translation: For thee were dug wells springing from the mountain, which murmuring round about pour streams of sweetness.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिः परथमं जायमानो महो जयोतिषः परमे वयोमन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiḥ prathamaṃ jāyamāno maho jyotiṣaḥ parame vyoman |
Translation: 4 Bṛhaspati, when first he had his being from mighty splendour in supremest heaven,

Sanskit Text: सप्तास्यस तुविजातो रवेण वि सप्तरश्मिर अधमत तमांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saptāsyas tuvijāto raveṇa vi saptaraśmir adhamat tamāṃsi ||
Translation: Strong, with his sevenfold mouth, with noise of thunder, with his seven rays, blew and dispersed the darkness.

Sanskit Text: स सुष्टुभा स रक्वता गणेन वलं रुरोज फलिगं रवेण |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa suṣṭubhā sa ṛkvatā ghaṇena valaṃ ruroja phalighaṃ raveṇa |
Translation: 5 With the loud-shouting band who sang his praises, with thunder, he destroyed obstructive Vala.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिर उस्रिया हव्यसूदः कनिक्रदद वावशतीर उद आजत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatir usriyā havyasūdaḥ kanikradad vāvaśatīr ud ājat ||
Translation: Bṛhaspati thundering drave forth the cattle, the lowing cows who make oblations ready.

Sanskit Text: एवा पित्रे विश्वदेवाय वर्ष्णे यज्ञैर विधेम नमसा हविर्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā pitre viśvadevāya vṛṣṇe yajñair vidhema namasā havirbhiḥ |
Translation: 6 Serve we with sacrifices, gifts, and homage even thus the Steer of all the Gods, the Father.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पते सुप्रजा वीरवन्तो वयं सयाम पतयो रयीणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspate suprajā vīravanto vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām ||
Translation: Bṛhaspati, may we be lords of riches, with noble progeny and store of heroes.

Sanskit Text: स इद राजा परतिजन्यानि विश्वा शुष्मेण तस्थाव अभि वीर्य्ण |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa id rājā pratijanyāni viśvā śuṣmeṇa tasthāv abhi vīryṇa |
Translation: 7 Surely that King by power and might heroic hath made him lord of all his foes' posses-ions,

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिं यः सुभ्र्तम बिभर्ति वल्गूयति वन्दते पूर्वभाजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiṃ yaḥ subhṛtam bibharti valghūyati vandate pūrvabhājam ||
Translation: Who cherishes Bṛhaspati well-tended, adorns and worships him as foremost sharer.

Sanskit Text: स इत कषेति सुधित ओकसि सवे तस्मा इळा पिन्वते विश्वदानीम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa it kṣeti sudhita okasi sve tasmā iḷā pinvate viśvadānīm |
Translation: 8 In his own house he dwells in peace and comfort: to him for ever holy food flows richly.

Sanskit Text: तस्मै विशः सवयम एवा नमन्ते यस्मिन बरह्मा राजनि पूर्व एति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmai viśaḥ svayam evā namante yasmin brahmā rājani pūrva eti ||
Translation: To him the people with free will pay homage-the King with whom the Brahman hath precedence.

Sanskit Text: अप्रतीतो जयति सं धनानि परतिजन्यान्य उत या सजन्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apratīto jayati saṃ dhanāni pratijanyāny uta yā sajanyā |
Translation: 9 He, unopposed, is master of the riches of his own subjects and of hostile people.

Sanskit Text: अवस्यवे यो वरिवः कर्णोति बरह्मणे राजा तम अवन्ति देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avasyave yo varivaḥ kṛṇoti brahmaṇe rājā tam avanti devāḥ ||
Translation: The Gods uphold that King with their protection who helps the Brahman when he seeks his favour.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रश च सोमम पिबतम बर्हस्पते ऽसमिन यज्ञे मन्दसाना वर्षण्वसू |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraś ca somam pibatam bṛhaspate 'smin yajñe mandasānā vṛṣaṇvasū |
Translation: 10 Indra, Bṛhaspati, rainers of treasure, rejoicing at this sacrifice drink the Soma.

Sanskit Text: आ वां विशन्त्व इन्दवः सवाभुवो ऽसमे रयिं सर्ववीरं नि यछतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ viśantv indavaḥ svābhuvo 'sme rayiṃ sarvavīraṃ ni yachatam ||
Translation: Let the abundant drops sink deep within you: vouchsafe us riches with full store of heroes.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पत इन्द्र वर्धतं नः सचा सा वां सुमतिर भूत्व अस्मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspata indra vardhataṃ naḥ sacā sā vāṃ sumatir bhūtv asme |
Translation: 11 Bṛhaspati and Indra, make us prosper may this be your benevolence to us-ward.

Sanskit Text: अविष्टं धियो जिग्र्तम पुरंधीर जजस्तम अर्यो वनुषाम अरातीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aviṣṭaṃ dhiyo jighṛtam puraṃdhīr jajastam aryo vanuṣām arātīḥ ||
Translation: Assist our holy thoughts, wake up our spirit: weaken the hatred of our foe and rivals.

Sanskit Text: इदम उ तयत पुरुतमम पुरस्ताज जयोतिस तमसो वयुनावद अस्थात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idam u tyat purutamam purastāj jyotis tamaso vayunāvad asthāt |
Translation: 1. FORTH from the darkness in the region eastward this most abundant splendid light hatb mounted.

Sanskit Text: नूनं दिवो दुहितरो विभातीर गातुं कर्णवन्न उषसो जनाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nūnaṃ divo duhitaro vibhātīr ghātuṃ kṛṇavann uṣaso janāya ||
Translation: Now verily the far-refulgent Mornings, Daughters of Heaven, bring welfare to the people.

Sanskit Text: अस्थुर उ चित्रा उषसः पुरस्तान मिता इव सवरवो ऽधवरेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asthur u citrā uṣasaḥ purastān mitā iva svaravo 'dhvareṣu |
Translation: 2 The richly-coloured Dawns have mounted eastward, like pillars planted at our sacrifices,

Sanskit Text: वय ऊ वरजस्य तमसो दवारोछन्तीर अव्रञ छुचयः पावकाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vy ū vrajasya tamaso dvārochantīr avrañ chucayaḥ pāvakāḥ ||
Translation: And, flushing far, splendid and purifying, unbarred the portals of the fold of darkness.

Sanskit Text: उछन्तीर अद्य चितयन्त भोजान राधोदेयायोषसो मघोनीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uchantīr adya citayanta bhojān rādhodeyāyoṣaso maghonīḥ |
Translation: 3 Dispelling gloom this day the wealthy Mornings urge liberal givers to present their treasures.

Sanskit Text: अचित्रे अन्तः पणयः ससन्त्व अबुध्यमानास तमसो विमध्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: acitre antaḥ paṇayaḥ sasantv abudhyamānās tamaso vimadhye ||
Translation: In the unlightened depth of darkness round them let niggard traffickers sleep unawakened.

Sanskit Text: कुवित स देवीः सनयो नवो वा यामो बभूयाद उषसो वो अद्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvit sa devīḥ sanayo navo vā yāmo babhūyād uṣaso vo adya |
Translation: 4 O Goddesses, is this your car, I ask you, ancient this day, or is it new, ye Mornings,

Sanskit Text: येना नवग्वे अङगिरे दशग्वे सप्तास्ये रेवती रेवद ऊष ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenā navaghve aṅghire daśaghve saptāsye revatī revad ūṣa ||
Translation: Wherewith, rich Dawns, ye seek with wealth Navagva, Daśagva Aṅgira, the seven-toned singer?

Sanskit Text: यूयं हि देवीर रतयुग्भिर अश्वैः परिप्रयाथ भुवनानि सद्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyaṃ hi devīr ṛtayughbhir aśvaiḥ pariprayātha bhuvanāni sadyaḥ |
Translation: 5 With horses harnessed by eternal Order, Goddesses, swiftly round the worlds ye travel,

Sanskit Text: परबोधयन्तीर उषसः ससन्तं दविपाच चतुष्पाच चरथाय जीवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prabodhayantīr uṣasaḥ sasantaṃ dvipāc catuṣpāc carathāya jīvam ||
Translation: Arousing from their rest, O Dawns, the sleeping, and all that lives, man, bird, and beast, to motion.

Sanskit Text: कव सविद आसां कतमा पुराणी यया विधाना विदधुर रभूणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kva svid āsāṃ katamā purāṇī yayā vidhānā vidadhur ṛbhūṇām |
Translation: 6 Which among these is eldest, and where is she through whom they fixed the Ṛbhus' regulations?

Sanskit Text: शुभं यच छुभ्रा उषसश चरन्ति न वि जञायन्ते सद्र्शीर अजुर्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śubhaṃ yac chubhrā uṣasaś caranti na vi jñāyante sadṛśīr ajuryāḥ ||
Translation: What time the splendid Dawns go forth for splendour, they are not known apart, alike, unwasting.

Sanskit Text: ता घा ता भद्रा उषसः पुरासुर अभिष्टिद्युम्ना रतजातसत्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā ghā tā bhadrā uṣasaḥ purāsur abhiṣṭidyumnā ṛtajātasatyāḥ |
Translation: 7 Blest were these Dawns of old, shining with succour, true with the truth that springs from holy Order;

Sanskit Text: यास्व ईजानः शशमान उक्थै सतुवञ छंसन दरविणं सद्य आप ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāsv ījānaḥ śaśamāna ukthai stuvañ chaṃsan draviṇaṃ sadya āpa ||
Translation: With whom the toiling worshipper, by praises, hymning and lauding, soon attained to riches.

Sanskit Text: ता आ चरन्ति समना पुरस्तात समानतः समना पप्रथानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā ā caranti samanā purastāt samānataḥ samanā paprathānāḥ |
Translation: 8 Hither from eastward all at once they travel, from one place spreading in the selfsame manner.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य देवीः सदसो बुधाना गवां न सर्गा उषसो जरन्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya devīḥ sadaso budhānā ghavāṃ na sarghā uṣaso jarante ||
Translation: Awaking, from the seat of holy Order the Godlike Dawns come nigh like troops of cattle.

Sanskit Text: ता इन नव एव समना समानीर अमीतवर्णा उषसश चरन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā in nv eva samanā samānīr amītavarṇā uṣasaś caranti |
Translation: 9 Thus they go forth with undiminished colours, these Mornings similar, in self-same fashion,

Sanskit Text: गूहन्तीर अभ्वम असितं रुशद्भिः शुक्रास तनूभिः शुचयो रुचानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghūhantīr abhvam asitaṃ ruśadbhiḥ śukrās tanūbhiḥ śucayo rucānāḥ ||
Translation: Concealing the gigantic might of darkness with radiant bodies bright and pure and shining.

Sanskit Text: रयिं दिवो दुहितरो विभातीः परजावन्तं यछतास्मासु देवीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rayiṃ divo duhitaro vibhātīḥ prajāvantaṃ yachatāsmāsu devīḥ |
Translation: 10 O Goddesses, O Heaven's refulgent Daughters, bestow upon us wealth with store of children.

Sanskit Text: सयोनाद आ वः परतिबुध्यमानाः सुवीर्यस्य पतयः सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: syonād ā vaḥ pratibudhyamānāḥ suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma ||
Translation: As from our pleasant place of rest ye rouse us may we be masters of heroic vigour.

Sanskit Text: तद वो दिवो दुहितरो विभातीर उप बरुव उषसो यज्ञकेतुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad vo divo duhitaro vibhātīr upa bruva uṣaso yajñaketuḥ |
Translation: 11 Well-skilled in lore of sacrifice, ye Daughters of Heaven, refulgent Dawns, I thus address you.

Sanskit Text: वयं सयाम यशसो जनेषु तद दयौश च धत्ताम पर्थिवी च देवी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ syāma yaśaso janeṣu tad dyauś ca dhattām pṛthivī ca devī ||
Translation: May we be glorious among the people. May Heaven vouchsafe us this, and Earth the Goddess,

Sanskit Text: तद देवस्य सवितुर वार्यम महद वर्णीमहे असुरस्य परचेतसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad devasya savitur vāryam mahad vṛṇīmahe asurasya pracetasaḥ |
Translation: 1. OF Savitar the God, the sapient Asura, we crave this great gift which is worthy of our choice,

Sanskit Text: छर्दिर येन दाशुषे यछति तमना तन नो महां उद अयान देवो अक्तुभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: chardir yena dāśuṣe yachati tmanā tan no mahāṃ ud ayān devo aktubhiḥ ||
Translation: Wherewith he freely grants his worshiper defence. This with his rays the Great God hath vouchsafed to us.

Sanskit Text: दिवो धर्ता भुवनस्य परजापतिः पिशङगं दरापिम परति मुञ्चते कविः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo dhartā bhuvanasya prajāpatiḥ piśaṅghaṃ drāpim prati muñcate kaviḥ |
Translation: 2 Sustainer of the heaven, Lord of the whole world's life, the Sage, he putteth on his golden-coloured mail.

Sanskit Text: विचक्षणः परथयन्न आप्र्णन्न उर्व अजीजनत सविता सुम्नम उक्थ्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vicakṣaṇaḥ prathayann āpṛṇann urv ajījanat savitā sumnam ukthyam ||
Translation: Clear-sighted, spreading far, filling the spacious realm, Savitar hath brought forth bliss that deserveth laud.

Sanskit Text: आप्रा रजांसि दिव्यानि पार्थिवा शलोकं देवः कर्णुते सवाय धर्मणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āprā rajāṃsi divyāni pārthivā ślokaṃ devaḥ kṛṇute svāya dharmaṇe |
Translation: 3 He hath filled full the regions of the heaven and earth: the God for his own strengthening waketh up the hymn.

Sanskit Text: पर बाहू अस्राक सविता सवीमनि निवेशयन परसुवन्न अक्तुभिर जगत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra bāhū asrāk savitā savīmani niveśayan prasuvann aktubhir jaghat ||
Translation: Savitar hath stretched out his arms to cherish life, producing with his rays and lulling all that moves.

Sanskit Text: अदाभ्यो भुवनानि परचाकशद वरतानि देवः सविताभि रक्षते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adābhyo bhuvanāni pracākaśad vratāni devaḥ savitābhi rakṣate |
Translation: 4 Lighting all living creatures, ne’er to be deceived, Savitar, God, protects each holy ordinance.

Sanskit Text: परास्राग बाहू भुवनस्य परजाभ्यो धर्तव्रतो महो अज्मस्य राजति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāsrāgh bāhū bhuvanasya prajābhyo dhṛtavrato maho ajmasya rājati ||
Translation: He hath stretched out his arms to all the folk of earth, and, with his laws observed, rules his own mighty course.

Sanskit Text: तरिर अन्तरिक्षं सविता महित्वना तरी रजांसि परिभुस तरीणि रोचना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trir antarikṣaṃ savitā mahitvanā trī rajāṃsi paribhus trīṇi rocanā |
Translation: 5 Savitar thrice surrounding with his mightiness mid-air, three regions, and the triple sphere of light,

Sanskit Text: तिस्रो दिवः पर्थिवीस तिस्र इन्वति तरिभिर वरतैर अभि नो रक्षति तमना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisro divaḥ pṛthivīs tisra invati tribhir vratair abhi no rakṣati tmanā ||
Translation: Sets the three heavens in motion and the threefold earth, and willingly protects us with his triple law.

Sanskit Text: बर्हत्सुम्नः परसवीता निवेशनो जगत सथातुर उभयस्य यो वशी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhatsumnaḥ prasavītā niveśano jaghata sthātur ubhayasya yo vaśī |
Translation: 6 Most gracious God, who brings to life and lulls to rest, he who controls the world, what moves not and what moves,

Sanskit Text: स नो देवः सविता शर्म यछत्व अस्मे कषयाय तरिवरूथम अंहसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no devaḥ savitā śarma yachatv asme kṣayāya trivarūtham aṃhasaḥ ||
Translation: May he vouchsafe us shelter,—Savitar the God,—for tranquil life, with triple bar against distress.

Sanskit Text: आगन देव रतुभिर वर्धतु कषयं दधातु नः सविता सुप्रजाम इषम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āghan deva ṛtubhir vardhatu kṣayaṃ dadhātu naḥ savitā suprajām iṣam |
Translation: 7 With the year's seasons hath Savitar, God, come nigh: may he prosper our home, give food and noble sons.

Sanskit Text: स नः कषपाभिर अहभिश च जिन्वतु परजावन्तं रयिम अस्मे सम इन्वतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ kṣapābhir ahabhiś ca jinvatu prajāvantaṃ rayim asme sam invatu ||
Translation: May he invigorate us through the days and nights, and may he send us opulence with progeny.

Sanskit Text: अभूद देवः सविता वन्द्यो नु न इदानीम अह्न उपवाच्यो नर्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhūd devaḥ savitā vandyo nu na idānīm ahna upavācyo nṛbhiḥ |
Translation: 1. Now must we praise and honour Savitar the God: at this time of the day the men must call to him,

Sanskit Text: वि यो रत्ना भजति मानवेभ्यः शरेष्ठं नो अत्र दरविणं यथा दधत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yo ratnā bhajati mānavebhyaḥ śreṣṭhaṃ no atra draviṇaṃ yathā dadhat ||
Translation: Him who distributes wealth to Manu's progeny, that he may grant us here riches most excellent.

Sanskit Text: देवेभ्यो हि परथमं यज्ञियेभ्यो ऽमर्तत्वं सुवसि भागम उत्तमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devebhyo hi prathamaṃ yajñiyebhyo 'mṛtatvaṃ suvasi bhāgham uttamam |
Translation: 2 For thou at first producest for the holy Gods the noblest of all portions, immortality:

Sanskit Text: आद इद दामानं सवितर वय ्र्णुषे ऽनूचीना जीविता मानुषेभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ād id dāmānaṃ savitar vy rṇuṣe 'nūcīnā jīvitā mānuṣebhyaḥ ||
Translation: Thereafter as a gift to men, O Savitar, thou openest existence, life succeeding life.

Sanskit Text: अचित्ती यच चक्र्मा दैव्ये जने दीनैर दक्षैः परभूती पूरुषत्वता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: acittī yac cakṛmā daivye jane dīnair dakṣaiḥ prabhūtī pūruṣatvatā |
Translation: 3 If we, men as we are, have sinned against the Gods through want of thought, in weakness, or through insolence,

Sanskit Text: देवेषु च सवितर मानुषेषु च तवं नो अत्र सुवताद अनागसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: deveṣu ca savitar mānuṣeṣu ca tvaṃ no atra suvatād anāghasaḥ ||
Translation: Absolve us from the guilt and make us free from sin, O Savitar, alike among both Gods and men.

Sanskit Text: न परमिये सवितुर दैव्यस्य तद यथा विश्वम भुवनं धारयिष्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na pramiye savitur daivyasya tad yathā viśvam bhuvanaṃ dhārayiṣyati |
Translation: 4 None may impede that power of Savitar the God whereby he will maintain the universal world.

Sanskit Text: यत पर्थिव्या वरिमन्न आ सवङगुरिर वर्ष्मन दिवः सुवति सत्यम अस्य तत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat pṛthivyā varimann ā svaṅghurir varṣman divaḥ suvati satyam asya tat ||
Translation: What the fair-fingered God brings forth on earth's expanse or in the height of heaven, that work of his stands sure.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रज्येष्ठान बर्हद्भ्यः पर्वतेभ्यः कषयां एभ्यः सुवसि पस्त्यावतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrajyeṣṭhān bṛhadbhyaḥ parvatebhyaḥ kṣayāṃ ebhyaḥ suvasi pastyāvataḥ |
Translation: 5 To lofty hills thou sendest those whom Indra leads, and givest fixed abodes with houses unto these.

Sanskit Text: यथा-यथा पतयन्तो वियेमिर एवैव तस्थुः सवितः सवाय ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā-yathā patayanto viyemira evaiva tasthuḥ savitaḥ savāya te ||
Translation: However they may fly and draw themselves apart, still, Savitar, they stand obeying thy behest.

Sanskit Text: ये ते तरिर अहन सवितः सवासो दिवे-दिवे सौभगम आसुवन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye te trir ahan savitaḥ savāso dive-dive saubhagham āsuvanti |
Translation: 6 May the libations poured to thee thrice daily, day after day, O Savitar, bring us blessing.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो दयावाप्र्थिवी सिन्धुर अद्भिर आदित्यैर नो अदितिः शर्म यंसत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro dyāvāpṛthivī sindhur adbhir ādityair no aditiḥ śarma yaṃsat ||
Translation: May Indra, Heaven, Earth, Sindhu with the Waters, Aditi with Ādityas, give us shelter.

Sanskit Text: मही दयावाप्र्थिवी इह जयेष्ठे रुचा भवतां शुचयद्भिर अर्कैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahī dyāvāpṛthivī iha jyeṣṭhe rucā bhavatāṃ śucayadbhir arkaiḥ |
Translation: 1. MAY mighty Heaven and Earth, most meet for honour, be present here with light and gleaming splendours;

Sanskit Text: यत सीं वरिष्ठे बर्हती विमिन्वन रुवद धोक्षा पप्रथानेभिर एवैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat sīṃ variṣṭhe bṛhatī viminvan ruvad dhokṣā paprathānebhir evaiḥ ||
Translation: When, fixing them apart, vast, most extensive, the Steer roars loudly in far-reaching courses.

Sanskit Text: देवी देवेभिर यजते यजत्रैर अमिनती तस्थतुर उक्षमाणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devī devebhir yajate yajatrair aminatī tasthatur ukṣamāṇe |
Translation: 2 The Goddesses with Gods, holy with holy, the Two stand pouring out their rain, exhaustless:

Sanskit Text: रतावरी अद्रुहा देवपुत्रे यज्ञस्य नेत्री शुचयद्भिर अर्कैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtāvarī adruhā devaputre yajñasya netrī śucayadbhir arkaiḥ ||
Translation: Faithful and guileless, having Gods for children, leaders of sacrifice with shining splendours.

Sanskit Text: स इत सवपा भुवनेष्व आस य इमे दयावाप्र्थिवी जजान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa it svapā bhuvaneṣv āsa ya ime dyāvāpṛthivī jajāna |
Translation: 3 Sure in the worlds he was a skilful Craftsman, he who produced these Twain the Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: उर्वी गभीरे रजसी सुमेके अवंशे धीरः शच्या सम ऐरत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: urvī ghabhīre rajasī sumeke avaṃśe dhīraḥ śacyā sam airat ||
Translation: Wise, with his power he brought both realms, together spacious and deep, well-fashioned, unsupported.

Sanskit Text: नू रोदसी बर्हद्भिर नो वरूथैः पत्नीवद्भिर इषयन्ती सजोषाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū rodasī bṛhadbhir no varūthaiḥ patnīvadbhir iṣayantī sajoṣāḥ |
Translation: 4 O Heaven and Earth, with one accord promoting, with high protection as of Queens, our welfare,

Sanskit Text: उरूची विश्वे यजते नि पातं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: urūcī viśve yajate ni pātaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ ||
Translation: Far-reaching, universal, holy, guard us. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

Sanskit Text: पर वाम महि दयवी अभ्य उपस्तुतिम भरामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vām mahi dyavī abhy upastutim bharāmahe |
Translation: 5 To both of you, O Heaven and Earth, we bring our lofty song of praise,

Sanskit Text: शुची उप परशस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śucī upa praśastaye ||
Translation: Pure Ones! to glorify you both.

Sanskit Text: पुनाने तन्वा मिथः सवेन दक्षेण राजथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: punāne tanvā mithaḥ svena dakṣeṇa rājathaḥ |
Translation: 6 Ye sanctify each other's form, by your own proper might ye rule,

Sanskit Text: ऊह्याथे सनाद रतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūhyāthe sanād ṛtam ||
Translation: And from of old observe the Law.

Sanskit Text: मही मित्रस्य साधथस तरन्ती पिप्रती रतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahī mitrasya sādhathas tarantī pipratī ṛtam |
Translation: 7 Furthering and fulfilling, ye, O Mighty, perfect Mitra's Law.

Sanskit Text: परि यज्ञं नि षेदथुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari yajñaṃ ni ṣedathuḥ ||
Translation: Ye sit around our sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: कषेत्रस्य पतिना वयं हितेनेव जयामसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣetrasya patinā vayaṃ hiteneva jayāmasi |
Translation: 1. WE through the Master of the Field, even as through a friend, obtain

Sanskit Text: गाम अश्वम पोषयित्न्व आ स नो मर्ळातीद्र्शे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghām aśvam poṣayitnv ā sa no mṛḷātīdṛśe ||
Translation: What nourisheth our kine and steeds. In such may he be good to us.

Sanskit Text: कषेत्रस्य पते मधुमन्तम ऊर्मिं धेनुर इव पयो अस्मासु धुक्ष्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣetrasya pate madhumantam ūrmiṃ dhenur iva payo asmāsu dhukṣva |
Translation: 2 As the cow yieldeth milk, pour for us freely, Lord of the Field, the wave that beareth sweetness,

Sanskit Text: मधुश्चुतं घर्तम इव सुपूतम रतस्य नः पतयो मर्ळयन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhuścutaṃ ghṛtam iva supūtam ṛtasya naḥ patayo mṛḷayantu ||
Translation: Distilling meath, well-purified like butter, and let the. Lords of holy Law be gracious.

Sanskit Text: मधुमतीर ओषधीर दयाव आपो मधुमन नो भवत्व अन्तरिक्षम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhumatīr oṣadhīr dyāva āpo madhuman no bhavatv antarikṣam |
Translation: 3 Sweet be the plants for us. the heavens, the waters, and full of sweets for us be air's mid-region.

Sanskit Text: कषेत्रस्य पतिर मधुमान नो अस्त्व अरिष्यन्तो अन्व एनं चरेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣetrasya patir madhumān no astv ariṣyanto anv enaṃ carema ||
Translation: May the Field's Lord for us be full of sweetness, and may we follow after him uninjured.

Sanskit Text: शुनं वाहाः शुनं नरः शुनं कर्षतु लाङगलम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śunaṃ vāhāḥ śunaṃ naraḥ śunaṃ kṛṣatu lāṅghalam |
Translation: 4 Happily work our steers and men, may the plough furrow happily.

Sanskit Text: शुनं वरत्रा बध्यन्तां शुनम अष्ट्राम उद इङगय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śunaṃ varatrā badhyantāṃ śunam aṣṭrām ud iṅghaya ||
Translation: Happily be the traces bound; happily may he ply the goad.

Sanskit Text: शुनासीराव इमां वाचं जुषेथां यद दिवि चक्रथुः पयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śunāsīrāv imāṃ vācaṃ juṣethāṃ yad divi cakrathuḥ payaḥ |
Translation: 5 Śuna and Sīra, welcome ye this laud, and with the milk which ye have made in heaven

Sanskit Text: तेनेमाम उप सिञ्चतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tenemām upa siñcatam ||
Translation: Bedew ye both this earth of ours.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाची सुभगे भव सीते वन्दामहे तवा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvācī subhaghe bhava sīte vandāmahe tvā |
Translation: 6 Auspicious Sītā, come thou near: we venerate and worship thee

Sanskit Text: यथा नः सुभगाससि यथा नः सुफलाससि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā naḥ subhaghāsasi yathā naḥ suphalāsasi ||
Translation: That thou mayst bless and prosper us and bring us fruits abundantly.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रः सीतां नि गर्ह्णातु ताम पूषानु यछतु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraḥ sītāṃ ni ghṛhṇātu tām pūṣānu yachatu |
Translation: 7 May Indra press the furrow down, may Pūṣan guide its course aright.

Sanskit Text: सा नः पयस्वती दुहाम उत्तराम-उत्तरां समाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā naḥ payasvatī duhām uttarām-uttarāṃ samām ||
Translation: May she, as rich in milk, be drained for us through each succeeding year.

Sanskit Text: शुनं नः फाला वि कर्षन्तु भूमिं शुनं कीनाशा अभि यन्तु वाहैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śunaṃ naḥ phālā vi kṛṣantu bhūmiṃ śunaṃ kīnāśā abhi yantu vāhaiḥ |
Translation: 8 Happily let the shares turn up the plough-land, happily go the ploughers with the oxen.

Sanskit Text: शुनम पर्जन्यो मधुना पयोभिः शुनासीरा शुनम अस्मासु धत्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śunam parjanyo madhunā payobhiḥ śunāsīrā śunam asmāsu dhattam ||
Translation: With meath and milk Parjanya make us happy. Grant us prosperity, Śuna and Sīra.

Sanskit Text: अबोध्य अग्निः समिधा जनानाम परति धेनुम इवायतीम उषासम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abodhy aghniḥ samidhā janānām prati dhenum ivāyatīm uṣāsam |
Translation: 1. Agni is wakened by the people's fuel to meet the Dawn who cometh like a milch-cow.

Sanskit Text: यह्वा इव पर वयाम उज्जिहानाः पर भानवः सिस्रते नाकम अछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yahvā iva pra vayām ujjihānāḥ pra bhānavaḥ sisrate nākam acha ||
Translation: Like young trees shooting up on high their branches, his flames are rising to the vault of heaven.

Sanskit Text: अबोधि होता यजथाय देवान ऊर्ध्वो अग्निः सुमनाः परातर अस्थात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abodhi hotā yajathāya devān ūrdhvo aghniḥ sumanāḥ prātar asthāt |
Translation: 2 For worship of the Gods the Priest was wakened: at morning gracious Agni hath arisen.

Sanskit Text: समिद्धस्य रुशद अदर्शि पाजो महान देवस तमसो निर अमोचि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samiddhasya ruśad adarśi pājo mahān devas tamaso nir amoci ||
Translation: Kindled, his radiant might is made apparent, and the great Deity set free from darkness.

Sanskit Text: यद ईं गणस्य रशनाम अजीगः शुचिर अङकते शुचिभिर गोभिर अग्निः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad īṃ ghaṇasya raśanām ajīghaḥ śucir aṅkte śucibhir ghobhir aghniḥ |
Translation: 3 When he hath stirred the line of his attendants, with the pure milk pure Agni is anointed.

Sanskit Text: आद दक्षिणा युज्यते वाजयन्त्य उत्तानाम ऊर्ध्वो अधयज जुहूभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ād dakṣiṇā yujyate vājayanty uttānām ūrdhvo adhayaj juhūbhiḥ ||
Translation: The strength-bestowing gift is then made ready, which spread in front, with tongues, erect, he drinketh.

Sanskit Text: अग्निम अछा देवयताम मनांसि चक्षूंषीव सूर्ये सं चरन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnim achā devayatām manāṃsi cakṣūṃṣīva sūrye saṃ caranti |
Translation: 4 The spirits of the pious turn together to Agni, as the eyes of all to Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: यद ईं सुवाते उषसा विरूपे शवेतो वाजी जायते अग्रे अह्नाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad īṃ suvāte uṣasā virūpe śveto vājī jāyate aghre ahnām ||
Translation: He, when both Dawns of different hues have borne him, springs up at daybreak as a strong white charger.

Sanskit Text: जनिष्ट हि जेन्यो अग्रे अह्नां हितो हितेष्व अरुषो वनेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: janiṣṭa hi jenyo aghre ahnāṃ hito hiteṣv aruṣo vaneṣu |
Translation: 5 The noble One was born at days' beginning, laid red in colour mid the well-laid fuel.

Sanskit Text: दमे-दमे सप्त रत्ना दधानो ऽगनिर होता नि षसादा यजीयान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dame-dame sapta ratnā dadhāno 'ghnir hotā ni ṣasādā yajīyān ||
Translation: Yielding in every house his seven rich treasures, Agni is seated, Priest most skilled in worship.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर होता नय असीदद यजीयान उपस्थे मातुः सुरभा उलोके |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnir hotā ny asīdad yajīyān upasthe mātuḥ surabhā uloke |
Translation: 6 Agni hath sat him down, a Priest most skilful, on a sweet-smelling place, his Mother's bosom.

Sanskit Text: युवा कविः पुरुनिष्ठ रतावा धर्ता कर्ष्टीनाम उत मध्य इद्धः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvā kaviḥ puruniṣṭha ṛtāvā dhartā kṛṣṭīnām uta madhya iddhaḥ ||
Translation: Young, faithful, sage, preeminent o’er many, kindled among the folk whom he sustaineth.

Sanskit Text: पर णु तयं विप्रम अध्वरेषु साधुम अग्निं होतारम ईळते नमोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ṇu tyaṃ vipram adhvareṣu sādhum aghniṃ hotāram īḷate namobhiḥ |
Translation: 7 This Singer excellent at sacrifices, Agni the Priest, they glorify with homage.

Sanskit Text: आ यस ततान रोदसी रतेन नित्यम मर्जन्ति वाजिनं घर्तेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yas tatāna rodasī ṛtena nityam mṛjanti vājinaṃ ghṛtena ||
Translation: Him who spread out both worlds by Law Eternal they balm with oil, strong Steed who never faileth.

Sanskit Text: मार्जाल्यो मर्ज्यते सवे दमूनाः कविप्रशस्तो अतिथिः शिवो नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mārjālyo mṛjyate sve damūnāḥ kavipraśasto atithiḥ śivo naḥ |
Translation: 8. He, worshipful House-Friend, in his home is worshipped, our own auspicious guest, lauded by sages.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रश्र्ङगो वर्षभस तदोजा विश्वां अग्ने सहसा परास्य अन्यान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasraśṛṅgho vṛṣabhas tadojā viśvāṃ aghne sahasā prāsy anyān ||
Translation: That strength the Bull with thousand horns possesses. In might, O Agni, thou excellest others.

Sanskit Text: पर सद्यो अग्ने अत्य एष्य अन्यान आविर यस्मै चारुतमो बभूथ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sadyo aghne aty eṣy anyān āvir yasmai cārutamo babhūtha |
Translation: 9 Thou quickly passest by all others, Agni, for him to whom thou hast appeared most lovely,

Sanskit Text: ईळेन्यो वपुष्यो विभावा परियो विशाम अतिथिर मानुषीणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: īḷenyo vapuṣyo vibhāvā priyo viśām atithir mānuṣīṇām ||
Translation: Wondrously fair, adorable, effulgent, the guest of men, the darling of the people.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्यम भरन्ति कषितयो यविष्ठ बलिम अग्ने अन्तित ओत दूरात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyam bharanti kṣitayo yaviṣṭha balim aghne antita ota dūrāt |
Translation: 10 To thee, Most Youthful God! to thee, O Agni from near and far the people bring their tribute.

Sanskit Text: आ भन्दिष्ठस्य सुमतिं चिकिद्धि बर्हत ते अग्ने महि शर्म भद्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā bhandiṣṭhasya sumatiṃ cikiddhi bṛhat te aghne mahi śarma bhadram ||
Translation: Mark well the prayer of him who best extols thee. Great, high, auspicious, Agni, is thy shelter.

Sanskit Text: आद्य रथम भानुमो भानुमन्तम अग्ने तिष्ठ यजतेभिः समन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādya ratham bhānumo bhānumantam aghne tiṣṭha yajatebhiḥ samantam |
Translation: 11 Ascend to-day thy splendid car, O Agni, in splendour, with the Holy Ones around it.

Sanskit Text: विद्वान पथीनाम उर्व अन्तरिक्षम एह देवान हविरद्याय वक्षि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidvān pathīnām urv antarikṣam eha devān haviradyāya vakṣi ||
Translation: Knowing the paths by mid-air's spacious region bring hither Gods to feast on our oblation.

Sanskit Text: अवोचाम कवये मेध्याय वचो वन्दारु वर्षभाय वर्ष्णे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avocāma kavaye medhyāya vaco vandāru vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe |
Translation: 12 To him adorable, sage, strong and mighty we have sung forth our song of praise and homage.

Sanskit Text: गविष्ठिरो नमसा सतोमम अग्नौ दिव्ञ्व रुक्मम उरुव्यञ्चम अश्रेत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghaviṣṭhiro namasā stomam aghnau divñva rukmam uruvyañcam aśret ||
Translation: Gavisthira hath raised with prayer to Agni this laud far-reaching, like gold light to heaven.

Sanskit Text: कुमारम माता युवतिः समुब्धं गुहा बिभर्ति न ददाति पित्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kumāram mātā yuvatiḥ samubdhaṃ ghuhā bibharti na dadāti pitre |
Translation: 1. THE youthful Mother keeps the Boy in secret pressed to her close, nor yields him to the Father.

Sanskit Text: अनीकम अस्य न मिनज जनासः पुरः पश्यन्ति निहितम अरतौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anīkam asya na minaj janāsaḥ puraḥ paśyanti nihitam aratau ||
Translation: But, when he lies upon the arm, the people see his unfading countenance before them.

Sanskit Text: कम एतं तवं युवते कुमारम पेषी बिभर्षि महिषी जजान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kam etaṃ tvaṃ yuvate kumāram peṣī bibharṣi mahiṣī jajāna |
Translation: 2 What child is this thou carriest as handmaid, O Youthful One? The Consort-Queen hath borne him.

Sanskit Text: पूर्वीर हि गर्भः शरदो ववर्धापश्यं जातं यद असूत माता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvīr hi gharbhaḥ śarado vavardhāpaśyaṃ jātaṃ yad asūta mātā ||
Translation: The Babe unborn increased through many autumns. I saw him born what time his Mother bare him.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यदन्तं शुचिवर्णम आरात कषेत्राद अपश्यम आयुधा मिमानम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyadantaṃ śucivarṇam ārāt kṣetrād apaśyam āyudhā mimānam |
Translation: 3 I saw him from afar gold-toothed, bright-coloured, hurling his weapons from his habitation,

Sanskit Text: ददानो अस्मा अम्र्तं विप्र्क्वत किम माम अनिन्द्राः कर्णवन्न अनुक्थाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadāno asmā amṛtaṃ vipṛkvat kim mām anindrāḥ kṛṇavann anukthāḥ ||
Translation: What time I gave him Amṛta free from mixture. How can the Indraless, the hymnless harm me?

Sanskit Text: कषेत्राद अपश्यं सनुतश चरन्तं सुमद यूथं न पुरु शोभमानम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣetrād apaśyaṃ sanutaś carantaṃ sumad yūthaṃ na puru śobhamānam |
Translation: 4 I saw him moving from the place he dwells in, even as with a herd, brilliantly shining.

Sanskit Text: न ता अग्र्भ्रन्न अजनिष्ट हि षः पलिक्नीर इद युवतयो भवन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na tā aghṛbhrann ajaniṣṭa hi ṣaḥ paliknīr id yuvatayo bhavanti ||
Translation: These seized him not: he had been born already. They who were grey with age again grow youthful.

Sanskit Text: के मे मर्यकं वि यवन्त गोभिर न येषां गोपा अरणश चिद आस |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ke me maryakaṃ vi yavanta ghobhir na yeṣāṃ ghopā araṇaś cid āsa |
Translation: 5 Who separate my young bull from the cattle, they whose protector was in truth no stranger?

Sanskit Text: य ईं जग्र्भुर अव ते सर्जन्त्व आजाति पश्व उप नश चिकित्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya īṃ jaghṛbhur ava te sṛjantv ājāti paśva upa naś cikitvān ||
Translation: Let those whose hands have seized upon them free them. May he, observant, drive the herd to us-ward.

Sanskit Text: वसां राजानं वसतिं जनानाम अरातयो नि दधुर मर्त्येषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasāṃ rājānaṃ vasatiṃ janānām arātayo ni dadhur martyeṣu |
Translation: 6 Mid mortal men godless have secreted the King of all who live, home of the people.

Sanskit Text: बरह्माण्य अत्रेर अव तं सर्जन्तु निन्दितारो निन्द्यासो भवन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmāṇy atrer ava taṃ sṛjantu ninditāro nindyāso bhavantu ||
Translation: So may the prayers of Atri give him freedom. Reproached in turn be those who now reproach him.

Sanskit Text: शुनश चिच छेपं निदितं सहस्राद यूपाद अमुञ्चो अशमिष्ट हि षः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śunaś cic chepaṃ niditaṃ sahasrād yūpād amuñco aśamiṣṭa hi ṣaḥ |
Translation: 7 Thou from the stake didst loose e’en Śunaḥśepa bound for a thousand; for he prayed with fervour.

Sanskit Text: एवास्मद अग्ने वि मुमुग्धि पाशान होतश चिकित्व इह तू निषद्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evāsmad aghne vi mumughdhi pāśān hotaś cikitva iha tū niṣadya ||
Translation: So, Agni, loose from us the bonds that bind us, when thou art seated here, O Priest who knowest.

Sanskit Text: हर्णीयमानो अप हि मद ऐयेः पर मे देवानां वरतपा उवाच |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hṛṇīyamāno apa hi mad aiyeḥ pra me devānāṃ vratapā uvāca |
Translation: 8 Thou hast sped from me, Agni, in thine anger: this the protector of Gods’ Laws hath told me.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो विद्वां अनु हि तवा चचक्ष तेनाहम अग्ने अनुशिष्ट आगाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro vidvāṃ anu hi tvā cacakṣa tenāham aghne anuśiṣṭa āghām ||
Translation: Indra who knoweth bent his eye upon thee: by him instructed am I come, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: वि जयोतिषा बर्हता भात्य अग्निर आविर विश्वानि कर्णुते महित्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi jyotiṣā bṛhatā bhāty aghnir āvir viśvāni kṛṇute mahitvā |
Translation: 9 Agni shines far and wide with lofty splendour, and by his greatness makes all things apparent.

Sanskit Text: परादेवीर मायाः सहते दुरेवाः शिशीते शर्ङगे रक्षसे विनिक्षे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prādevīr māyāḥ sahate durevāḥ śiśīte śṛṅghe rakṣase vinikṣe ||
Translation: He conquers godless and malign enchantments, and sharpens both his horns to gore the Rakṣas.

Sanskit Text: उत सवानासो दिवि षन्त्व अग्नेस तिग्मायुधा रक्षसे हन्तवा उ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta svānāso divi ṣantv aghnes tighmāyudhā rakṣase hantavā u |
Translation: 10 Loud in the heaven above be Agni's roarings with keen-edged weapons to destroy the demons.

Sanskit Text: मदे चिद अस्य पर रुजन्ति भामा न वरन्ते परिबाधो अदेवीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: made cid asya pra rujanti bhāmā na varante paribādho adevīḥ ||
Translation: Forth burst his splendours in the Soma's rapture. The godless bands press round but cannot stay him.

Sanskit Text: एतं ते सतोमं तुविजात विप्रो रथं न धीरः सवपा अतक्षम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etaṃ te stomaṃ tuvijāta vipro rathaṃ na dhīraḥ svapā atakṣam |
Translation: 11 As a skilled craftsman makes a car, a singer I, Mighty One! this hymn for thee have fashioned.

Sanskit Text: यदीद अग्ने परति तवं देव हर्याः सवर्वतीर अप एना जयेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadīd aghne prati tvaṃ deva haryāḥ svarvatīr apa enā jayema ||
Translation: If thou, O Agni, God, accept it gladly, may we obtain thereby the heavenly Waters.

Sanskit Text: तुविग्रीवो वर्षभो वाव्र्धानो ऽशत्र्व अर्यः सम अजाति वेदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tuvighrīvo vṛṣabho vāvṛdhāno 'śatrv aryaḥ sam ajāti vedaḥ |
Translation: 12 May he, the strong-necked Steer, waxing in vigour, gather the foeman's wealth with none to check him.

Sanskit Text: इतीमम अग्निम अम्र्ता अवोचन बर्हिष्मते मनवे शर्म यंसद धविष्मते मनवे शर्म यंसत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: itīmam aghnim amṛtā avocan barhiṣmate manave śarma yaṃsad dhaviṣmate manave śarma yaṃsat ||
Translation: Thus to this Agni have the Immortals spoken. To man who spreads the grass may he grant shelter, grant shelter to the man who brings oblation.

Sanskit Text: तवम अग्ने वरुणो जायसे यत तवम मित्रो भवसि यत समिद्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvam aghne varuṇo jāyase yat tvam mitro bhavasi yat samiddhaḥ |
Translation: 1. THOU at thy birth art Varuṇa, O Agni; when thou art kindled thou becomest Mitra.

Sanskit Text: तवे विश्वे सहसस पुत्र देवास तवम इन्द्रो दाशुषे मर्त्याय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve viśve sahasas putra devās tvam indro dāśuṣe martyāya ||
Translation: In thee, O Son of Strength, all Gods are centred. Indra art thou to man who brings oblation.

Sanskit Text: तवम अर्यमा भवसि यत कनीनां नाम सवधावन गुह्यम बिभर्षि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvam aryamā bhavasi yat kanīnāṃ nāma svadhāvan ghuhyam bibharṣi |
Translation: 2 Aryaman art thou as regardeth maidens mysterious, is thy name, O Self-sustainer.

Sanskit Text: अञ्जन्ति मित्रं सुधितं न गोभिर यद दम्पती समनसा कर्णोषि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: añjanti mitraṃ sudhitaṃ na ghobhir yad dampatī samanasā kṛṇoṣi ||
Translation: As a kind friend with streams of milk they balm thee what time thou makest wife and lord one-minded.

Sanskit Text: तव शरिये मरुतो मर्जयन्त रुद्र यत ते जनिम चारु चित्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava śriye maruto marjayanta rudra yat te janima cāru citram |
Translation: 3 The Maruts deck their beauty for thy glory, yea, Rudra! for thy birth fair, brightly-coloured.

Sanskit Text: पदं यद विष्णोर उपमं निधायि तेन पासि गुह्यं नाम गोनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: padaṃ yad viṣṇor upamaṃ nidhāyi tena pāsi ghuhyaṃ nāma ghonām ||
Translation: That which was fixed as Viṣṇu's loftiest station—therewith the secret of the Cows thou guardest.

Sanskit Text: तव शरिया सुद्र्शो देव देवाः पुरू दधाना अम्र्तं सपन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava śriyā sudṛśo deva devāḥ purū dadhānā amṛtaṃ sapanta |
Translation: 4 Gods through thy glory, God who art so lovely! granting abundant gifts gained life immortal.

Sanskit Text: होतारम अग्निम मनुषो नि षेदुर दशस्यन्त उशिजः शंसम आयोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotāram aghnim manuṣo ni ṣedur daśasyanta uśijaḥ śaṃsam āyoḥ ||
Translation: As their own Priest have men established Agni; and serve him fain for praise from him who liveth.

Sanskit Text: न तवद धोता पूर्वो अग्ने यजीयान न काव्यैः परो अस्ति सवधावः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na tvad dhotā pūrvo aghne yajīyān na kāvyaiḥ paro asti svadhāvaḥ |
Translation: 5 There is no priest more skilled than thou in worship; none Self-sustainer pass thee in wisdom.

Sanskit Text: विशश च यस्या अतिथिर भवासि स यज्ञेन वनवद देव मर्तान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśaś ca yasyā atithir bhavāsi sa yajñena vanavad deva martān ||
Translation: The man within whose house as guest thou dwellest, O God, by sacrifice shall conquer mortals.

Sanskit Text: वयम अग्ने वनुयाम तवोता वसूयवो हविषा बुध्यमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayam aghne vanuyāma tvotā vasūyavo haviṣā budhyamānāḥ |
Translation: 6 Aided by thee, O Agni may we conquer through our oblation, fain for wealth, awakened:

Sanskit Text: वयं समर्ये विदथेष्व अह्नां वयं राया सहसस पुत्र मर्तान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ samarye vidatheṣv ahnāṃ vayaṃ rāyā sahasas putra martān ||
Translation: May we in battle, in the days’ assemblies, O Son of Strength, by riches conquer mortals.

Sanskit Text: यो न आगो अभ्य एनो भरात्य अधीद अघम अघशंसे दधात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo na āgho abhy eno bharāty adhīd agham aghaśaṃse dadhāta |
Translation: 7 He shall bring evil on the evil-plotter whoever turns against us sin and outrage.

Sanskit Text: जही चिकित्वो अभिशस्तिम एताम अग्ने यो नो मर्चयति दवयेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jahī cikitvo abhiśastim etām aghne yo no marcayati dvayena ||
Translation: Destroy this calumny of him, O Agni, whoever injures us with double-dealing.

Sanskit Text: तवाम अस्या वयुषि देव पूर्वे दूतं कर्ण्वाना अयजन्त हव्यैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvām asyā vyuṣi deva pūrve dūtaṃ kṛṇvānā ayajanta havyaiḥ |
Translation: 8 At this dawn's flushing, God! our ancient fathers served thee with offerings, making thee their envoy,

Sanskit Text: संस्थे यद अग्न ईयसे रयीणां देवो मर्तैर वसुभिर इध्यमानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃsthe yad aghna īyase rayīṇāṃ devo martair vasubhir idhyamānaḥ ||
Translation: When, Agni, to the store of wealth thou goest, a God enkindled with good things by mortals.

Sanskit Text: अव सप्र्धि पितरं योधि विद्वान पुत्रो यस ते सहसः सून ऊहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava spṛdhi pitaraṃ yodhi vidvān putro yas te sahasaḥ sūna ūhe |
Translation: 9 Save, thou who knowest, draw thy father near thee, who counts as thine own son, O Child of Power.

Sanskit Text: कदा चिकित्वो अभि चक्षसे नो ऽगने कदां रतचिद यातयासे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadā cikitvo abhi cakṣase no 'ghne kadāṃ ṛtacid yātayāse ||
Translation: O sapient Agni, when wilt thou regard us? When, skilled in holy Law, wilt thou direct us?

Sanskit Text: भूरि नाम वन्दमानो दधाति पिता वसो यदि तज जोषयासे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūri nāma vandamāno dadhāti pitā vaso yadi taj joṣayāse |
Translation: 10 Adoring thee he gives thee many a title, when thou, Good Lord! acceptest this as Father.

Sanskit Text: कुविद देवस्य सहसा चकानः सुम्नम अग्निर वनते वाव्र्धानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvid devasya sahasā cakānaḥ sumnam aghnir vanate vāvṛdhānaḥ ||
Translation: And doth not Agni, glad in strength of Godhead, gain splendid bliss when he hath waxen mighty?

Sanskit Text: तवम अङग जरितारं यविष्ठ विश्वान्य अग्ने दुरिताति पर्षि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvam aṅgha jaritāraṃ yaviṣṭha viśvāny aghne duritāti parṣi |
Translation: 11 Most Youthful Agni, verily thou bearest thy praiser safely over all his troubles.

Sanskit Text: सतेना अद्र्श्रन रिपवो जनासो ऽजञातकेता वर्जिना अभूवन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stenā adṛśran ripavo janāso 'jñātaketā vṛjinā abhūvan ||
Translation: Thieves have been seen by us and open foemen: unknown have been the plottings of the wicked.

Sanskit Text: इमे यामासस तवद्रिग अभूवन वसवे वा तद इद आगो अवाचि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime yāmāsas tvadrigh abhūvan vasave vā tad id āgho avāci |
Translation: 12 To thee these eulogies have been directed: or to the Vasu hath this sin been spoken.

Sanskit Text: नाहायम अग्निर अभिशस्तये नो न रीषते वाव्र्धानः परा दात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāhāyam aghnir abhiśastaye no na rīṣate vāvṛdhānaḥ parā dāt ||
Translation: But this our Agni, flaming high, shall never yield us to calumny, to him who wrongs us.

Sanskit Text: तवाम अग्ने वसुपतिं वसूनाम अभि पर मन्दे अध्वरेषु राजन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvām aghne vasupatiṃ vasūnām abhi pra mande adhvareṣu rājan |
Translation: 1. O AGNI, King and Lord of wealth and treasures, in thee is my delight at sacrifices.

Sanskit Text: तवया वाजं वाजयन्तो जयेमाभि षयाम पर्त्सुतीर मर्त्यानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā vājaṃ vājayanto jayemābhi ṣyāma pṛtsutīr martyānām ||
Translation: Through thee may we obtain the strength we long for, and overcome the fierce attacks of mortals.

Sanskit Text: हव्यवाळ अग्निर अजरः पिता नो विभुर विभावा सुद्र्शीको अस्मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: havyavāḷ aghnir ajaraḥ pitā no vibhur vibhāvā sudṛśīko asme |
Translation: 2 Agni, Eternal Father, offering-bearer, fair to behold, far-reaching, far-refulgent,

Sanskit Text: सुगार्हपत्याः सम इषो दिदीह्य अस्मद्र्यक सम मिमीहि शरवांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sughārhapatyāḥ sam iṣo didīhy asmadryak sam mimīhi śravāṃsi ||
Translation: From well-kept household fire beam food to feed us, and measure out to us abundant glory.

Sanskit Text: विशां कविं विश्पतिम मानुषीणां शुचिम पावकं घर्तप्र्ष्ठम अग्निम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśāṃ kaviṃ viśpatim mānuṣīṇāṃ śucim pāvakaṃ ghṛtapṛṣṭham aghnim |
Translation: 3 The Sage of men, the Lord of human races, pure, purifying Agni, balmed with butter,

Sanskit Text: नि होतारं विश्वविदं दधिध्वे स देवेषु वनते वार्याणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni hotāraṃ viśvavidaṃ dadhidhve sa deveṣu vanate vāryāṇi ||
Translation: Him the Omniscient as your Priest ye stablish: he wins among the Gods things worth the choosing.

Sanskit Text: जुषस्वाग्न इळया सजोषा यतमानो रश्मिभिः सूर्यस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣasvāghna iḷayā sajoṣā yatamāno raśmibhiḥ sūryasya |
Translation: 4 Agni, enjoy, of one accord with Iḷā, striving in rivalry with beams of Sūrya,

Sanskit Text: जुषस्व नः समिधं जातवेद आ च देवान हविरद्याय वक्षि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣasva naḥ samidhaṃ jātaveda ā ca devān haviradyāya vakṣi ||
Translation: Enjoy, O Jātavedas, this our fuel, and bring the Gods to us to taste oblations.

Sanskit Text: जुष्टो दमूना अतिथिर दुरोण इमं नो यज्ञम उप याहि विद्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣṭo damūnā atithir duroṇa imaṃ no yajñam upa yāhi vidvān |
Translation: 5 As dear House-Friend, guest welcome in the dwelling, to this our sacrifice come thou who knowest.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा अग्ने अभियुजो विहत्या शत्रूयताम आ भरा भोजनानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā aghne abhiyujo vihatyā śatrūyatām ā bharā bhojanāni ||
Translation: And, Agni, having scattered all assailants, bring to us the possessions of our foemen.

Sanskit Text: वधेन दस्युम पर हि चातयस्व वयः कर्ण्वानस तन्वे सवायै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vadhena dasyum pra hi cātayasva vayaḥ kṛṇvānas tanve svāyai |
Translation: 6 Drive thou away the Dasyu with thy weapon. As, gaining vital power for thine own body,

Sanskit Text: पिपर्षि यत सहसस पुत्र देवान्त सो अग्ने पाहि नर्तम वाजे अस्मान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: piparṣi yat sahasas putra devānt so aghne pāhi nṛtama vāje asmān ||
Translation: O Son of Strength, the Gods thou satisfiest, so in fight save us, most heroic Agni.

Sanskit Text: वयं ते अग्न उक्थैर विधेम वयं हव्यैः पावक भद्रशोचे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ te aghna ukthair vidhema vayaṃ havyaiḥ pāvaka bhadraśoce |
Translation: 7 May we, O Agni, with our lauds adore thee, and with our gifts, fair-beaming Purifier!

Sanskit Text: अस्मे रयिं विश्ववारं सम इन्वास्मे विश्वानि दरविणानि धेहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme rayiṃ viśvavāraṃ sam invāsme viśvāni draviṇāni dhehi ||
Translation: Send to us wealth containing all things precious: bestow upon us every sort of riches.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकम अग्ने अध्वरं जुषस्व सहसः सूनो तरिषधस्थ हव्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākam aghne adhvaraṃ juṣasva sahasaḥ sūno triṣadhastha havyam |
Translation: 8 Son of Strength, Agni, dweller in three regions, accept our sacrifice and our oblation.

Sanskit Text: वयं देवेषु सुक्र्तः सयाम शर्मणा नस तरिवरूथेन पाहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ deveṣu sukṛtaḥ syāma śarmaṇā nas trivarūthena pāhi ||
Translation: Among the Gods may we be counted pious: protect us with a triply-guarding shelter.

Sanskit Text: विश्वानि नो दुर्गहा जातवेदः सिन्धुं न नावा दुरिताति पर्षि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāni no durghahā jātavedaḥ sindhuṃ na nāvā duritāti parṣi |
Translation: 9 Over all woes and dangers, Jātavedas, bear us as in a boat across a river.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने अत्रिवन नमसा गर्णानो ऽसमाकम बोध्य अविता तनूनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne atrivan namasā ghṛṇāno 'smākam bodhy avitā tanūnām ||
Translation: Praised with our homage even as Atri praised thee, O Agni, be the guardian of our bodies.

Sanskit Text: यस तवा हर्दा कीरिणा मन्यमानो ऽमर्त्यम मर्त्यो जोहवीमि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yas tvā hṛdā kīriṇā manyamāno 'martyam martyo johavīmi |
Translation: 10 As I, remembering thee with grateful spirit, a mortal, call with might on thee Immortal,

Sanskit Text: जातवेदो यशो अस्मासु धेहि परजाभिर अग्ने अम्र्तत्वम अश्याम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jātavedo yaśo asmāsu dhehi prajābhir aghne amṛtatvam aśyām ||
Translation: Vouchsafe us high renown, O Jātavedas, and may I be immortal by my children.

Sanskit Text: यस्मै तवं सुक्र्ते जातवेद उलोकम अग्ने कर्णवः सयोनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasmai tvaṃ sukṛte jātaveda ulokam aghne kṛṇavaḥ syonam |
Translation: 11 The pious man, O Jātavedas Agni, to whom thou grantest ample room and pleasure,

Sanskit Text: अश्विनं स पुत्र्णं वीरवन्तं गोमन्तं रयिं नशते सवस्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvinaṃ sa putṛṇaṃ vīravantaṃ ghomantaṃ rayiṃ naśate svasti ||
Translation: Gaineth abundant wealth with sons and horses, with heroes and with kine for his well-being.

Sanskit Text: सखायः सं वः सम्यञ्चम इषं सतोमं चाग्नये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhāyaḥ saṃ vaḥ samyañcam iṣaṃ stomaṃ cāghnaye |
Translation: 1. OFFER to Agni, O my friends, your seemly food, your seemly praise;

Sanskit Text: वर्षिष्ठाय कषितीनाम ऊर्जो नप्त्रे सहस्वते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: varṣiṣṭhāya kṣitīnām ūrjo naptre sahasvate ||
Translation: To him supremest o’er the folk, the Son of Strength, the mighty Lord:

Sanskit Text: कुत्रा चिद यस्य सम्र्तौ रण्वा नरो नर्षदने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kutrā cid yasya samṛtau raṇvā naro nṛṣadane |
Translation: 2 Him in whose presence, when they meet in full assembly, men rejoice;

Sanskit Text: अर्हन्तश चिद यम इन्धते संजनयन्ति जन्तवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arhantaś cid yam indhate saṃjanayanti jantavaḥ ||
Translation: Even him whom worthy ones inflame, and living creatures bring to life.

Sanskit Text: सं यद इषो वनामहे सं हव्या मानुषाणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yad iṣo vanāmahe saṃ havyā mānuṣāṇām |
Translation: 3 When we present to him the food and sacrificial gifts of men,

Sanskit Text: उत दयुम्नस्य शवस रतस्य रश्मिम आ ददे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta dyumnasya śavasa ṛtasya raśmim ā dade ||
Translation: He by the might of splendour grasps the holy Ordinance's rein.

Sanskit Text: स समा कर्णोति केतुम आ नक्तं चिद दूर आ सते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa smā kṛṇoti ketum ā naktaṃ cid dūra ā sate |
Translation: 4 He gives a signal in the night even to him who is afar,

Sanskit Text: पावको यद वनस्पतीन पर समा मिनात्य अजरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāvako yad vanaspatīn pra smā mināty ajaraḥ ||
Translation: When he, the Bright, unchanged by eld, consumes the sovrans of the wood.

Sanskit Text: अव सम यस्य वेषणे सवेदम पथिषु जुह्वति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava sma yasya veṣaṇe svedam pathiṣu juhvati |
Translation: 5 He in whose service on the ways they offer up their drops of sweat,

Sanskit Text: अभीम अह सवजेन्यम भूमा पर्ष्ठेव रुरुहुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhīm aha svajenyam bhūmā pṛṣṭheva ruruhuḥ ||
Translation: On him is their high kin have they mounted, as ridges on the earth.

Sanskit Text: यम मर्त्यः पुरुस्प्र्हं विदद विश्वस्य धायसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yam martyaḥ puruspṛhaṃ vidad viśvasya dhāyase |
Translation: 6 Whom, sought of many, mortal man hath found to be the Stay of all;

Sanskit Text: पर सवादनम पितूनाम अस्ततातिं चिद आयवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra svādanam pitūnām astatātiṃ cid āyave ||
Translation: He who gives flavour to our food, the home of every man that lives.

Sanskit Text: स हि षमा धन्वाक्षितं दाता न दात्य आ पशुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi ṣmā dhanvākṣitaṃ dātā na dāty ā paśuḥ |
Translation: 7 Even as a herd that crops the grass he shears the field and wilderness,

Sanskit Text: हिरिश्मश्रुः शुचिदन्न रभुर अनिभ्र्ष्टतविषिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiriśmaśruḥ śucidann ṛbhur anibhṛṣṭataviṣiḥ ||
Translation: With flashing teeth and beard of gold, deft with his unabated might.

Sanskit Text: शुचिः षमा यस्मा अत्रिवत पर सवधितीव रीयते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuciḥ ṣmā yasmā atrivat pra svadhitīva rīyate |
Translation: 8 For him, to whom, bright as an axe he, as to Atri, hath flashed forth,

Sanskit Text: सुषूर असूत माता कराणा यद आनशे भगम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suṣūr asūta mātā krāṇā yad ānaśe bhagham ||
Translation: Hath the well-bearing Mother borne, producing when her time is come.

Sanskit Text: आ यस ते सर्पिरासुते ऽगने शम अस्ति धायसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yas te sarpirāsute 'ghne śam asti dhāyase |
Translation: 9 Agni to whom the oil is shed by him thou lovest to support,

Sanskit Text: ऐषु दयुम्नम उत शरव आ चित्तम मर्त्येषु धाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aiṣu dyumnam uta śrava ā cittam martyeṣu dhāḥ ||
Translation: Bestow upon these mortals fame and splendour and intelligence.

Sanskit Text: इति चिन मन्युम अध्रिजस तवादातम आ पशुं ददे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iti cin manyum adhrijas tvādātam ā paśuṃ dade |
Translation: 10 Such zeal hath he, resistless one: he gained the cattle given by thee.

Sanskit Text: आद अग्ने अप्र्णतो ऽतरिः सासह्याद दस्यून इषः सासह्यान नॄन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ād aghne apṛṇato 'triḥ sāsahyād dasyūn iṣaḥ sāsahyān nṝn ||
Translation: Agni, may Atri overcome the Dasyus who bestow no gifts, subdue the men who give no food.

Sanskit Text: तवाम अग्ने हविष्मन्तो देवम मर्तास ईळते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvām aghne haviṣmanto devam martāsa īḷate |
Translation: 1. BEARING; oblations mortal men, O Agni, worship thee the God.

Sanskit Text: मन्ये तवा जातवेदसं स हव्या वक्ष्य आनुषक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manye tvā jātavedasaṃ sa havyā vakṣy ānuṣak ||
Translation: I deem thee Jātavedas: bear our offerings, thou, unceasingly.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर होता दास्वतः कषयस्य वर्क्तबर्हिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnir hotā dāsvataḥ kṣayasya vṛktabarhiṣaḥ |
Translation: 2 In the man's home who offers gifts, where grass is trimmed, Agni is Priest,

Sanskit Text: सं यज्ञासश चरन्ति यं सं वाजासः शरवस्यवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yajñāsaś caranti yaṃ saṃ vājāsaḥ śravasyavaḥ ||
Translation: To whom all sacrifices come and strengthenings that win renown.

Sanskit Text: उत सम यं शिशुं यथा नवं जनिष्टारणी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta sma yaṃ śiśuṃ yathā navaṃ janiṣṭāraṇī |
Translation: 3 Whom, as an infant newly-born, the kindling-sticks have brought to life,

Sanskit Text: धर्तारम मानुषीणां विशाम अग्निं सवध्वरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhartāram mānuṣīṇāṃ viśām aghniṃ svadhvaram ||
Translation: Sustainer of the tribes of men, skilled in well-ordered sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: उत सम दुर्ग्र्भीयसे पुत्रो न हवार्याणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta sma durghṛbhīyase putro na hvāryāṇām |
Translation: 4 Yea, very hard art thou to grasp, like offspring of the wriggling snakes,

Sanskit Text: पुरू यो दग्धासि वनाग्ने पशुर न यवसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purū yo daghdhāsi vanāghne paśur na yavase ||
Translation: When thou consumest many woods like an ox, Agni, in the mead.

Sanskit Text: अध सम यस्यार्चयः सम्यक संयन्ति धूमिनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha sma yasyārcayaḥ samyak saṃyanti dhūminaḥ |
Translation: 5 Whose flames, when thou art sending forth the smoke, completely reach the mark,

Sanskit Text: यद ईम अह तरितो दिव्य उप धमातेव धमति शिशीते धमातरी यथा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad īm aha trito divy upa dhmāteva dhamati śiśīte dhmātarī yathā ||
Translation: When Tṛta in the height of heaven, like as a smelter fanneth thee, e’en as a smelter sharpeneth thee.

Sanskit Text: तवाहम अग्न ऊतिभिर मित्रस्य च परशस्तिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tavāham aghna ūtibhir mitrasya ca praśastibhiḥ |
Translation: 6 O Agni, by thy succour and by Mitra's friendly furtherance,

Sanskit Text: दवेषोयुतो न दुरिता तुर्याम मर्त्यानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dveṣoyuto na duritā turyāma martyānām ||
Translation: May we, averting hate,

Sanskit Text: <a href="errata.htm#17">
subdue
the wickedness of mortal men.
तं नो अग्ने अभी नरो रयिं सहस्व आ भर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ no aghne abhī naro rayiṃ sahasva ā bhara |
Translation: 7 O Agni, to our heroes bring such riches, thou victorious God.

Sanskit Text: स कषेपयत स पोषयद भुवद वाजस्य सातय उतैधि पर्त्सु नो वर्धे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa kṣepayat sa poṣayad bhuvad vājasya sātaya utaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe ||
Translation: May he protect and nourish us, and help in gaining strength: be thou near us in fight for our success.

Sanskit Text: अग्न ओजिष्ठम आ भर दयुम्नम अस्मभ्यम अध्रिगो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghna ojiṣṭham ā bhara dyumnam asmabhyam adhrigho |
Translation: 1. BRING us most mighty splendour thou, Agni, resistless on thy way.

Sanskit Text: पर नो राया परीणसा रत्सि वाजाय पन्थाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra no rāyā parīṇasā ratsi vājāya panthām ||
Translation: With overflowing store of wealth mark out for us a path to strength.

Sanskit Text: तवं नो अग्ने अद्भुत करत्वा दक्षस्य मंहना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ no aghne adbhuta kratvā dakṣasya maṃhanā |
Translation: 2 Ours art thou, wondrous Agni, by wisdom and bounteousness of power.

Sanskit Text: तवे असुर्यम आरुहत कराणा मित्रो न यज्ञियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve asuryam āruhat krāṇā mitro na yajñiyaḥ ||
Translation: The might of Asuras rests on thee, like Mitra worshipful in act.

Sanskit Text: तवं नो अग्न एषां गयम पुष्टिं च वर्धय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ no aghna eṣāṃ ghayam puṣṭiṃ ca vardhaya |
Translation: 3 Agni, increase our means of life, increase the house and home of these,

Sanskit Text: ये सतोमेभिः पर सूरयो नरो मघान्य आनशुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye stomebhiḥ pra sūrayo naro maghāny ānaśuḥ ||
Translation: The men, the princes who have won great riches through our hymns of praise.

Sanskit Text: ये अग्ने चन्द्र ते गिरः शुम्भन्त्य अश्वराधसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye aghne candra te ghiraḥ śumbhanty aśvarādhasaḥ |
Translation: 4 Bright Agni, they who deck their songs for thee have horses as their meed.

Sanskit Text: शुष्मेभिः शुष्मिणो नरो दिवश चिद येषाम बर्हत सुकीर्तिर बोधति तमना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuṣmebhiḥ śuṣmiṇo naro divaś cid yeṣām bṛhat sukīrtir bodhati tmanā ||
Translation: The men are mighty in their might, they whose high laud, as that of heaven, awakes thee of its own accord.

Sanskit Text: तव तये अग्ने अर्चयो भराजन्तो यन्ति धर्ष्णुया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava tye aghne arcayo bhrājanto yanti dhṛṣṇuyā |
Translation: 5 O Agni, those resplendent flames of thine go valorously forth,

Sanskit Text: परिज्मानो न विद्युतः सवानो रथो न वाजयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parijmāno na vidyutaḥ svāno ratho na vājayuḥ ||
Translation: Like lightnings flashing round us, like a rattling car that seeks the spoil.

Sanskit Text: नू नो अग्न ऊतये सबाधसश च रातये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū no aghna ūtaye sabādhasaś ca rātaye |
Translation: 6 Now, Agni, come to succour us; let priests draw nigh to offer gifts;

Sanskit Text: अस्माकासश च सूरयो विश्वा आशास तरीषणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākāsaś ca sūrayo viśvā āśās tarīṣaṇi ||
Translation: And let the patrons of our rites subdue all regions of the earth.

Sanskit Text: तवं नो अग्ने अङगिर सतुत सतवान आ भर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ no aghne aṅghira stuta stavāna ā bhara |
Translation: 7 Bring to us, Agni, Aṅgiras, lauded of old and lauded now,

Sanskit Text: होतर विभ्वासहं रयिं सतोत्र्भ्य सतवसे च न उतैधि पर्त्सु नो वर्धे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotar vibhvāsahaṃ rayiṃ stotṛbhya stavase ca na utaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe ||
Translation: Invoker! wealth to quell the strong, that singers may extol thee. Be near us in fight for our success.

Sanskit Text: जनस्य गोपा अजनिष्ट जाग्र्विर अग्निः सुदक्षः सुविताय नव्यसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: janasya ghopā ajaniṣṭa jāghṛvir aghniḥ sudakṣaḥ suvitāya navyase |
Translation: 1. THE watchful Guardian of the people hath been born, Agni, the very strong, for fresh prosperity.

Sanskit Text: घर्तप्रतीको बर्हता दिविस्प्र्शा दयुमद वि भाति भरतेभ्यः शुचिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtapratīko bṛhatā divispṛśā dyumad vi bhāti bharatebhyaḥ śuciḥ ||
Translation: With oil upon his face, with high heaven-touching flame, he shineth splendidly, pure, for the Bharatas.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञस्य केतुम परथमम पुरोहितम अग्निं नरस तरिषधस्थे सम ईधिरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñasya ketum prathamam purohitam aghniṃ naras triṣadhasthe sam īdhire |
Translation: 2 Ensign of sacrifice, the earliest Household-Priest, the men have kindled Agni in his threefold seat,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रेण देवैः सरथं स बर्हिषि सीदन नि होता यजथाय सुक्रतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indreṇa devaiḥ sarathaṃ sa barhiṣi sīdan ni hotā yajathāya sukratuḥ ||
Translation: With Indra and the Gods together on the grass let the wise Priest sit to complete the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: असम्म्र्ष्टो जायसे मात्रोः शुचिर मन्द्रः कविर उद अतिष्ठो विवस्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asammṛṣṭo jāyase mātroḥ śucir mandraḥ kavir ud atiṣṭho vivasvataḥ |
Translation: 3 Pure , unadorned, from thy two Mothers art thou born: thou camest from Vivasvān as a charming Sage.

Sanskit Text: घर्तेन तवावर्धयन्न अग्न आहुत धूमस ते केतुर अभवद दिवि शरितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtena tvāvardhayann aghna āhuta dhūmas te ketur abhavad divi śritaḥ ||
Translation: With oil they strengthened thee, O Agni, worshipped God: thy banner was the smoke that mounted to the sky.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर नो यज्ञम उप वेतु साधुयाग्निं नरो वि भरन्ते गर्हे-गर्हे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnir no yajñam upa vetu sādhuyāghniṃ naro vi bharante ghṛhe-ghṛhe |
Translation: 4 May Agni graciously come to our sacrifice. The men bear Agni here and there in every house.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर दूतो अभवद धव्यवाहनो ऽगनिं वर्णाना वर्णते कविक्रतुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnir dūto abhavad dhavyavāhano 'ghniṃ vṛṇānā vṛṇate kavikratum ||
Translation: He hath become an envoy, bearer of our gifts: electing Agni, men choose one exceeding wise.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्येदम अग्ने मधुमत्तमं वचस तुभ्यम मनीषा इयम अस्तु शं हर्दे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyedam aghne madhumattamaṃ vacas tubhyam manīṣā iyam astu śaṃ hṛde |
Translation: 5 For thee, O Agni, is this sweetest prayer of mine: dear to thy spirit be this product of my thought.

Sanskit Text: तवां गिरः सिन्धुम इवावनीर महीर आ पर्णन्ति शवसा वर्धयन्ति च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ ghiraḥ sindhum ivāvanīr mahīr ā pṛṇanti śavasā vardhayanti ca ||
Translation: As great streams fill the river so our song of praise fill thee, and make thee yet more mighty in thy strength.

Sanskit Text: तवाम अग्ने अङगिरसो गुहा हितम अन्व अविन्दञ छिश्रियाणं वने वने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvām aghne aṅghiraso ghuhā hitam anv avindañ chiśriyāṇaṃ vane vane |
Translation: 6 O Agni, the Aṅgirases discovered thee what time thou layest hidden, fleeing back from wood to wood.

Sanskit Text: स जायसे मथ्यमानः सहो महत तवाम आहुः सहसस पुत्रम अङगिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa jāyase mathyamānaḥ saho mahat tvām āhuḥ sahasas putram aṅghiraḥ ||
Translation: Thou by attrition art produced as conquering might, and men, O Aṅgiras, call thee the Son of Strength.

Sanskit Text: पराग्नये बर्हते यज्ञियाय रतस्य वर्ष्णे असुराय मन्म |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāghnaye bṛhate yajñiyāya ṛtasya vṛṣṇe asurāya manma |
Translation: 1. To Agni, lofty Asura, meet for worship, Steer of eternal Law, my prayer I offer;

Sanskit Text: घर्तं न यज्ञ आस्य सुपूतं गिरम भरे वर्षभाय परतीचीम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtaṃ na yajña āsy supūtaṃ ghiram bhare vṛṣabhāya pratīcīm ||
Translation: I bring my song directed to the Mighty like pure oil for his mouth at sacrifices.

Sanskit Text: रतं चिकित्व रतम इच चिकिद्ध्य रतस्य धारा अनु तर्न्धि पूर्वीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtaṃ cikitva ṛtam ic cikiddhy ṛtasya dhārā anu tṛndhi pūrvīḥ |
Translation: 2 Mark the Law, thou who knowest, yea, observe it: send forth the full streams of eternal Order.
