Sanskit Text: नाहं यातुं सहसा न दवयेन रतं सपाम्य अरुषस्य वर्ष्णः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāhaṃ yātuṃ sahasā na dvayena ṛtaṃ sapāmy aruṣasya vṛṣṇaḥ ||
Translation: I use no sorcery with might or falsehood the sacred Law of the Red Steer I follow.

Sanskit Text: कया नो अग्न रतयन्न रतेन भुवो नवेदा उचथस्य नव्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kayā no aghna ṛtayann ṛtena bhuvo navedā ucathasya navyaḥ |
Translation: 3 How hast thou, follower of the Law eternal, become the knower of a new song, Agni?

Sanskit Text: वेदा मे देव रतुपा रतूनां नाहम पतिं सनितुर अस्य रायः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vedā me deva ṛtupā ṛtūnāṃ nāham patiṃ sanitur asya rāyaḥ ||
Translation: The God, the Guardian of the seasons, knows me: the Lord of him who won this wealth I know not.

Sanskit Text: के ते अग्ने रिपवे बन्धनासः के पायवः सनिषन्त दयुमन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ke te aghne ripave bandhanāsaḥ ke pāyavaḥ saniṣanta dyumantaḥ |
Translation: 4 Who, Agni, in alliance with thy foeman, what splendid helpers won for them their riches?

Sanskit Text: के धासिम अग्ने अन्र्तस्य पान्ति क आसतो वचसः सन्ति गोपाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ke dhāsim aghne anṛtasya pānti ka āsato vacasaḥ santi ghopāḥ ||
Translation: Agni, who guard the dwelling-place of falsehood? Who are protectors of the speech of liars?

Sanskit Text: सखायस ते विषुणा अग्न एते शिवासः सन्तो अशिवा अभूवन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhāyas te viṣuṇā aghna ete śivāsaḥ santo aśivā abhūvan |
Translation: 5 Agni, those friends of thine have turned them from thee: gracious of old, they have become ungracious.

Sanskit Text: अधूर्षत सवयम एते वचोभिर रजूयते वर्जिनानि बरुवन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhūrṣata svayam ete vacobhir ṛjūyate vṛjināni bruvantaḥ ||
Translation: They have deceived themselves by their own speeches, uttering wicked words against the righteous.

Sanskit Text: यस ते अग्ने नमसा यज्ञम ईट्ट रतं स पात्य अरुषस्य वर्ष्णः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yas te aghne namasā yajñam īṭṭa ṛtaṃ sa pāty aruṣasya vṛṣṇaḥ |
Translation: 6 He who pays sacrifice to thee with homage, O Agni, keeps the Red Steer's Law eternal;

Sanskit Text: तस्य कषयः पर्थुर आ साधुर एतु परसर्स्राणस्य नहुषस्य शेषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya kṣayaḥ pṛthur ā sādhur etu prasarsrāṇasya nahuṣasya śeṣaḥ ||
Translation: Wide is his dwelling. May the noble offspring of Nahuṣa who wandered forth come hither.

Sanskit Text: अर्चन्तस तवा हवामहे ऽरचन्तः सम इधीमहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arcantas tvā havāmahe 'rcantaḥ sam idhīmahi |
Translation: 1. WITH songs of praise we call on thee, we kindle thee with songs of praise,

Sanskit Text: अग्ने अर्चन्त ऊतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne arcanta ūtaye ||
Translation: Agni, with songs of praise, for help.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने सतोमम मनामहे सिध्रम अद्य दिविस्प्र्शः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne stomam manāmahe sidhram adya divispṛśaḥ |
Translation: 2 Eager for wealth, we meditate Agni's effectual praise to-day,

Sanskit Text: देवस्य दरविणस्यवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devasya draviṇasyavaḥ ||
Translation: Praise of the God who touches heaven.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर जुषत नो गिरो होता यो मानुषेष्व आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnir juṣata no ghiro hotā yo mānuṣeṣv ā |
Translation: 3 May Agni, Priest among mankind, take pleasure in our songs of praise,

Sanskit Text: स यक्षद दैव्यं जनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa yakṣad daivyaṃ janam ||
Translation: And worship the Celestial Folk.

Sanskit Text: तवम अग्ने सप्रथा असि जुष्टो होता वरेण्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvam aghne saprathā asi juṣṭo hotā vareṇyaḥ |
Translation: 4 Thou, Agni, art spread widely forth, Priest dear and excellent; through thee

Sanskit Text: तवया यज्ञं वि तन्वते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā yajñaṃ vi tanvate ||
Translation: Men make the sacrifice complete.

Sanskit Text: तवाम अग्ने वाजसातमं विप्रा वर्धन्ति सुष्टुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvām aghne vājasātamaṃ viprā vardhanti suṣṭutam |
Translation: 5 Singers exalt thee, Agni, well lauded, best giver of our strength:

Sanskit Text: स नो रास्व सुवीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no rāsva suvīryam ||
Translation: So grant thou us heroic might.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने नेमिर अरां इव देवांस तवम परिभूर असि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne nemir arāṃ iva devāṃs tvam paribhūr asi |
Translation: 6 Thou Agni, as the felly rings the spokes, encompassest the Gods.

Sanskit Text: आ राधश चित्रम रञ्जसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā rādhaś citram ṛñjase ||
Translation: I yearn for bounty manifold.

Sanskit Text: पर वेधसे कवये वेद्याय गिरम भरे यशसे पूर्व्याय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vedhase kavaye vedyāya ghiram bhare yaśase pūrvyāya |
Translation: 1. To him, the far-renowned, the wise Ordainer, ancient and glorious, a song I offer.

Sanskit Text: घर्तप्रसत्तो असुरः सुशेवो रायो धर्ता धरुणो वस्वो अग्निः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtaprasatto asuraḥ suśevo rāyo dhartā dharuṇo vasvo aghniḥ ||
Translation: Enthroned in oil, the Asura, bliss-giver, is Agni, firm support of noble, riches.

Sanskit Text: रतेन रतं धरुणं धारयन्त यज्ञस्य शाके परमे वयोमन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtena ṛtaṃ dharuṇaṃ dhārayanta yajñasya śāke parame vyoman |
Translation: 2 By holy Law they kept supporting Order, by help of sacrifice, in loftiest heaven,—

Sanskit Text: दिवो धर्मन धरुणे सेदुषो नञ्ञ जातैर अजातां अभि ये ननक्षुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo dharman dharuṇe seduṣo nññ jātair ajātāṃ abhi ye nanakṣuḥ ||
Translation: They who attained with born men to the unborn, men seated on that stay, heaven's firm sustainer.

Sanskit Text: अङहोयुवस तन्वस तन्वते वि वयो महद दुष्टरम पूर्व्याय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṅhoyuvas tanvas tanvate vi vayo mahad duṣṭaram pūrvyāya |
Translation: 3 Averting woe, they labour hard to bring him, the ancient, plenteous food as power resistless.

Sanskit Text: स संवतो नवजातस तुतुर्यात सिङहं न करुद्धम अभितः परि षठुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa saṃvato navajātas tuturyāt siṅhaṃ na kruddham abhitaḥ pari ṣṭhuḥ ||
Translation: May he, born newly, conquer his assailants: round him they stand as round an angry lion.

Sanskit Text: मातेव यद भरसे पप्रथानो जनं-जनं धायसे चक्षसे च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: māteva yad bharase paprathāno janaṃ-janaṃ dhāyase cakṣase ca |
Translation: 4 When, like a mother, spreading forth to nourish, to cherish and regard each man that liveth,—

Sanskit Text: वयो-वयो जरसे यद दधानः परि तमना विषुरूपो जिगासि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayo-vayo jarase yad dadhānaḥ pari tmanā viṣurūpo jighāsi ||
Translation: Consuming all the strength that thou hast gotten, thou wanderest round, thyself, in varied fashion.

Sanskit Text: वाजो नु ते शवसस पात्व अन्तम उरुं दोघं धरुणं देव रायः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājo nu te śavasas pātv antam uruṃ doghaṃ dharuṇaṃ deva rāyaḥ |
Translation: 5 May strength preserve the compass of thy vigour, God! that broad stream of thine that beareth riches.

Sanskit Text: पदं न तायुर गुहा दधानो महो राये चितयन्न अत्रिम अस्पः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: padaṃ na tāyur ghuhā dadhāno maho rāye citayann atrim aspaḥ ||
Translation: Thou, like a thief who keeps his refuge secret, hast holpen Atri to great wealth, by teaching.

Sanskit Text: बर्हद वयो हि भानवे ऽरचा देवायाग्नये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhad vayo hi bhānave 'rcā devāyāghnaye |
Translation: 1. GREAT power is in the beam of light, sing praise to, Agni, to the God

Sanskit Text: यम मित्रं न परशस्तिभिर मर्तासो दधिरे पुरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yam mitraṃ na praśastibhir martāso dadhire puraḥ ||
Translation: Whom men have set in foremost place like Mitra with their eulogies.

Sanskit Text: स हि दयुभिर जनानां होता दक्षस्य बाह्वोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi dyubhir janānāṃ hotā dakṣasya bāhvoḥ |
Translation: 2 He by the splendour of his arms is Priest of every able man.

Sanskit Text: वि हव्यम अग्निर आनुषग भगो न वारम रण्वति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi havyam aghnir ānuṣagh bhagho na vāram ṛṇvati ||
Translation: Agni conveys oblation straight, and deals, as Bhaga deals, his boons.

Sanskit Text: अस्य सतोमे मघोनः सख्ये वर्द्धशोचिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya stome maghonaḥ sakhye vṛddhaśociṣaḥ |
Translation: 3 All rests upon the laud and love of him the rich, high-flaming God,

Sanskit Text: विश्वा यस्मिन तुविष्वणि सम अर्ये शुष्मम आदधुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā yasmin tuviṣvaṇi sam arye śuṣmam ādadhuḥ ||
Translation: On whom, loud-roaring, men have laid great strength as on a faithful friend.

Sanskit Text: अधा हय अग्न एषां सुवीर्यस्य मंहना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā hy aghna eṣāṃ suvīryasya maṃhanā |
Translation: 4 So, Agni, be the Friend of these with liberal gift of hero strength.

Sanskit Text: तम इद यह्वं न रोदसी परि शरवो बभूवतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tam id yahvaṃ na rodasī pari śravo babhūvatuḥ ||
Translation: Yea, Heaven and Earth have not surpassed this Youthful One in glorious fame.

Sanskit Text: नू न एहि वार्यम अग्ने गर्णान आ भर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū na ehi vāryam aghne ghṛṇāna ā bhara |
Translation: 5 O Agni, quickly come to us, and, glorified, bring precious wealth.

Sanskit Text: ये वयं ये च सूरयः सवस्ति धामहे सचोतैधि पर्त्सु नो वर्धे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye vayaṃ ye ca sūrayaḥ svasti dhāmahe sacotaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe ||
Translation: So we and these our princes will assemble for the good of all. Be near in fight to prosper us.

Sanskit Text: आ यज्ञैर देव मर्त्य इत्था तव्यांसम ऊतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yajñair deva martya itthā tavyāṃsam ūtaye |
Translation: 1. GOD, may a mortal call the Strong hither, with solemn rites, to aid,

Sanskit Text: अग्निं कर्ते सवध्वरे पूरुर ईळीतावसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ kṛte svadhvare pūrur īḷītāvase ||
Translation: A man call Agni to protect when sacrifice is well prepared.

Sanskit Text: अस्य हि सवयशस्तर आसा विधर्मन मन्यसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya hi svayaśastara āsā vidharman manyase |
Translation: 2 Near him thou seemest mightier still in native glory, set to hold

Sanskit Text: तं नाकं चित्रशोचिषम मन्द्रम परो मनीषया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ nākaṃ citraśociṣam mandram paro manīṣayā ||
Translation: Apart yon flame-hued vault of heaven, lovely beyond the thought of man.

Sanskit Text: अस्य वासा उ अर्चिषा य आयुक्त तुजा गिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya vāsā u arciṣā ya āyukta tujā ghirā |
Translation: 3 Yea, this is by the light of him whom powerful song hath bound to act,

Sanskit Text: दिवो न यस्य रेतसा बर्हच छोचन्त्य अर्चयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo na yasya retasā bṛhac chocanty arcayaḥ ||
Translation: Whose beams of splendour flash on high as though they sprang from heavenly seed.

Sanskit Text: अस्य करत्वा विचेतसो दस्मस्य वसु रथ आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya kratvā vicetaso dasmasya vasu ratha ā |
Translation: 4 Wealth loads the Wonder-Worker's car through his, the very wise One's power.

Sanskit Text: अधा विश्वासु हव्यो ऽगनिर विक्षु पर शस्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā viśvāsu havyo 'ghnir vikṣu pra śasyate ||
Translation: Then, meet to be invoked among all tribes, is Agni glorified.

Sanskit Text: नू न इद धि वार्यम आसा सचन्त सूरयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū na id dhi vāryam āsā sacanta sūrayaḥ |
Translation: 5 Now, too, the princes shall obtain excellent riches by our lips.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्जो नपाद अभिष्टये पाहि शग्धि सवस्तय उतैधि पर्त्सु नो वर्धे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrjo napād abhiṣṭaye pāhi śaghdhi svastaya utaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe ||
Translation: Protect us for our welfare: lend thy succour, O thou Son of Strength. Be near in fight to prosper us.

Sanskit Text: परातर अग्निः पुरुप्रियो विश सतवेतातिथिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātar aghniḥ purupriyo viśa stavetātithiḥ |
Translation: 1. AT dawn let Agni, much-beloved guest of the house, be glorified;

Sanskit Text: विश्वानि यो अमर्त्यो हव्या मर्तेषु रण्यति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāni yo amartyo havyā marteṣu raṇyati ||
Translation: Immortal who delights in all oblations brought by mortal men.

Sanskit Text: दविताय मर्क्तवाहसे सवस्य दक्षस्य मंहना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvitāya mṛktavāhase svasya dakṣasya maṃhanā |
Translation: 2 For Dvita who receives through wealth of native strength maimed offerings,

Sanskit Text: इन्दुं स धत्त आनुषक सतोता चित ते अमर्त्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: induṃ sa dhatta ānuṣak stotā cit te amartya ||
Translation: Thy praiser even gains at once the Soma-drops, Immortal Gods!

Sanskit Text: तं वो दीर्घायुशोचिषं गिरा हुवे मघोनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vo dīrghāyuśociṣaṃ ghirā huve maghonām |
Translation: 3 Nobles, with song I call that car of yours that shines with lengthened life,

Sanskit Text: अरिष्टो येषां रथो वय अश्वदावन्न ईयते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ariṣṭo yeṣāṃ ratho vy aśvadāvann īyate ||
Translation: For, God who givest steeds! that car hither and thither goes unharmed.

Sanskit Text: चित्रा वा येषु दीधितिर आसन्न उक्था पान्ति ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: citrā vā yeṣu dīdhitir āsann ukthā pānti ye |
Translation: 4 They who have varied ways of thought, who guard the lauds within their lips,

Sanskit Text: सतीर्णम बर्हिः सवर्णरे शरवांसि दधिरे परि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stīrṇam barhiḥ svarṇare śravāṃsi dadhire pari ||
Translation: And strew the grass before the light, have decked themselves with high renown.

Sanskit Text: ये मे पञ्चाशतं ददुर अश्वानां सधस्तुति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye me pañcāśataṃ dadur aśvānāṃ sadhastuti |
Translation: 5 Immortal Agni, give the chiefs, heroes who institute the rite,

Sanskit Text: दयुमद अग्ने महि शरवो बर्हत कर्धि मघोनां नर्वद अम्र्त नर्णाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyumad aghne mahi śravo bṛhat kṛdhi maghonāṃ nṛvad amṛta nṛṇām ||
Translation: Heroes’ illustrious, lofty fame, who at the synod met for praise presented me with fifty steeds.

Sanskit Text: अभ्य अवस्थाः पर जायन्ते पर वव्रेर वव्रिश चिकेत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhy avasthāḥ pra jāyante pra vavrer vavriś ciketa |
Translation: 1. ONE state begets another state: husk is made visible from husk:

Sanskit Text: उपस्थे मातुर वि चष्टे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upasthe mātur vi caṣṭe ||
Translation: Within his Mother's side he speaks.

Sanskit Text: जुहुरे वि चितयन्तो ऽनिमिषं नर्म्णम पान्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: juhure vi citayanto 'nimiṣaṃ nṛmṇam pānti |
Translation: 2 Discerning, have they offered gifts: they guard the strength that never wastes.

Sanskit Text: आ दर्ळ्हाम पुरं विविशुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā dṛḷhām puraṃ viviśuḥ ||
Translation: To a strong fort have they pressed in.

Sanskit Text: आ शवैत्रेयस्य जन्तवो दयुमद वर्धन्त कर्ष्टयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā śvaitreyasya jantavo dyumad vardhanta kṛṣṭayaḥ |
Translation: 3 Śvaitreya's people, all his men, have gloriously increased in might.

Sanskit Text: निष्कग्रीवो बर्हदुक्थ एना मध्वा न वाजयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niṣkaghrīvo bṛhaduktha enā madhvā na vājayuḥ ||
Translation: A gold chain Bṛhaduktha wears, as, through this Soma, seeking spoil.

Sanskit Text: परियं दुग्धं न काम्यम अजामि जाम्योः सचा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyaṃ dughdhaṃ na kāmyam ajāmi jāmyoḥ sacā |
Translation: 4 I bring, as ’twere, the longed-for milk, the dear milk of the Sister-Pair.

Sanskit Text: घर्मो न वाजजठरो ऽदब्धः शश्वतो दभः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: gharmo na vājajaṭharo 'dabdhaḥ śaśvato dabhaḥ ||
Translation: Like to a caldron filled with food is he, unconquered, conquering all.

Sanskit Text: करीळन नो रश्म आ भुवः सम भस्मना वायुना वेविदानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: krīḷan no raśma ā bhuvaḥ sam bhasmanā vāyunā vevidānaḥ |
Translation: 5 Beam of light, come to us in sportive fashion, finding thyself close to the wind that fans thee.

Sanskit Text: ता अस्य सन धर्षजो न तिग्माः सुसंशिता वक्ष्यो वक्षणेस्थाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā asya san dhṛṣajo na tighmāḥ susaṃśitā vakṣyo vakṣaṇesthāḥ ||
Translation: These flames of his are wasting flames, like arrows keen-pointed, sharpened, on his breast.

Sanskit Text: यम अग्ने वाजसातम तवं चिन मन्यसे रयिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yam aghne vājasātama tvaṃ cin manyase rayim |
Translation: 1. AGNI, best winner of the spoil, cause us to praise before the Gods

Sanskit Text: तं नो गीर्भिः शरवाय्यं देवत्रा पनया युजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ no ghīrbhiḥ śravāyyaṃ devatrā panayā yujam ||
Translation: As our associate meet for lauds, wealth which thou verily deemest wealth.

Sanskit Text: ये अग्ने नेरयन्ति ते वर्द्धा उग्रस्य शवसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye aghne nerayanti te vṛddhā ughrasya śavasaḥ |
Translation: 2 Agni, the great who ward not off the anger of thy power and might

Sanskit Text: अप दवेषो अप हवरो ऽनयव्रतस्य सश्चिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa dveṣo apa hvaro 'nyavratasya saścire ||
Translation: Stir up the wrath and hatred due to one who holds an alien creed.

Sanskit Text: होतारं तवा वर्णीमहे ऽगने दक्षस्य साधनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotāraṃ tvā vṛṇīmahe 'ghne dakṣasya sādhanam |
Translation: 3 Thee, Agni, would we choose as Priest, the perfecter of strength and skill;

Sanskit Text: यज्ञेषु पूर्व्यं गिरा परयस्वन्तो हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñeṣu pūrvyaṃ ghirā prayasvanto havāmahe ||
Translation: We who bring sacred food invoke with song thee Chief at holy rites.

Sanskit Text: इत्था यथा त ऊतये सहसावन दिवे-दिवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: itthā yathā ta ūtaye sahasāvan dive-dive |
Translation: 4 Here as is needful for thine aid we toil, O Conqueror, day by day,

Sanskit Text: राय रताय सुक्रतो गोभिः षयाम सधमादो वीरैः सयाम सधमादः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāya ṛtāya sukrato ghobhiḥ ṣyāma sadhamādo vīraiḥ syāma sadhamādaḥ ||
Translation: For wealth, for Law. May we rejoice, Most Wise One! at the feast, with kine, rejoice, with heroes, at the feast.

Sanskit Text: मनुष्वत तवा नि धीमहि मनुष्वत सम इधीमहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: manuṣvat tvā ni dhīmahi manuṣvat sam idhīmahi |
Translation: 1. WE stablish thee as Manus used, as Manus used we kindle thee.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने मनुष्वद अङगिरो देवान देवयते यज ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne manuṣvad aṅghiro devān devayate yaja ||
Translation: Like Manus, for the pious man , Aṅgiras, Agni, worship Gods.

Sanskit Text: तवं हि मानुषे जने ऽगने सुप्रीत इध्यसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hi mānuṣe jane 'ghne suprīta idhyase |
Translation: 2 For well, O Agni, art thou pleased when thou art kindled mid mankind.

Sanskit Text: सरुचस तवा यन्त्य आनुषक सुजात सर्पिरासुते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: srucas tvā yanty ānuṣak sujāta sarpirāsute ||
Translation: Straight go the ladles unto thee, thou highborn God whose food is oil.

Sanskit Text: तवां विश्वे सजोषसो देवासो दूतम अक्रत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ viśve sajoṣaso devāso dūtam akrata |
Translation: 3 Thee have all Gods of one accord established as their messenger.

Sanskit Text: सपर्यन्तस तवा कवे यज्ञेषु देवम ईळते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saparyantas tvā kave yajñeṣu devam īḷate ||
Translation: Serving at sacrifices men adore thee as a God, O Sage.

Sanskit Text: देवं वो देवयज्ययाग्निम ईळीत मर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devaṃ vo devayajyayāghnim īḷīta martyaḥ |
Translation: 4 Let mortal man adore your God, Agni, with worship due to Gods.

Sanskit Text: समिद्धः शुक्र दीदिह्य रतस्य योनिम आसदः ससस्य योनिम आसदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samiddhaḥ śukra dīdihy ṛtasya yonim āsadaḥ sasasya yonim āsadaḥ ||
Translation: Shine forth enkindled, Radiant One. Sit in the chamber of the Law, sit in the chamber of the food.

Sanskit Text: पर विश्वसामन्न अत्रिवद अर्चा पावकशोचिषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra viśvasāmann atrivad arcā pāvakaśociṣe |
Translation: 1. LIKE Atri, Viśvasāman! sing to him of purifying light,

Sanskit Text: यो अध्वरेष्व ईड्यो होता मन्द्रतमो विशि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo adhvareṣv īḍyo hotā mandratamo viśi ||
Translation: Who must be praised in holy rites, the Priest most welcome in the house.

Sanskit Text: नय अग्निं जातवेदसं दधाता देवम रत्विजम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ny aghniṃ jātavedasaṃ dadhātā devam ṛtvijam |
Translation: 2 Set Jātavedas in his place, Agni the God and Minister.

Sanskit Text: पर यज्ञ एत्व आनुषग अद्या देवव्यचस्तमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yajña etv ānuṣagh adyā devavyacastamaḥ ||
Translation: Let sacrifice proceed to-day duly, comprising all the Gods.

Sanskit Text: चिकित्विन्मनसं तवा देवम मर्तास ऊतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: cikitvinmanasaṃ tvā devam martāsa ūtaye |
Translation: 3 All mortals come to thee for aid, the God of most observant mind.

Sanskit Text: वरेण्यस्य ते ऽवस इयानासो अमन्महि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vareṇyasya te 'vasa iyānāso amanmahi ||
Translation: Of thine excelling favour we bethink us as we long for it.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने चिकिद्ध्य अस्य न इदं वचः सहस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne cikiddhy asya na idaṃ vacaḥ sahasya |
Translation: 4 Mark with attention this our speech, O Agni, thou victorious One.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा सुशिप्र दम्पते सतोमैर वर्धन्त्य अत्रयो गीर्भिः शुम्भन्त्य अत्रयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā suśipra dampate stomair vardhanty atrayo ghīrbhiḥ śumbhanty atrayaḥ ||
Translation: Thee, Strong-jawed! as the homestead's Lord, the Atris with their lauds exalt, the Atris beautify with songs.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने सहन्तम आ भर दयुम्नस्य परासहा रयिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne sahantam ā bhara dyumnasya prāsahā rayim |
Translation: 1. By thy fair splendour's mighty power, O Agni, bring victorious wealth,

Sanskit Text: विश्वा यश चर्षणीर अभ्य रसा वाजेषु सासहत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā yaś carṣaṇīr abhy ṛsā vājeṣu sāsahat ||
Translation: Wealth that o’ercometh all mankind, and, near us, conquereth in fight.

Sanskit Text: तम अग्ने पर्तनाषहं रयिं सहस्व आ भर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tam aghne pṛtanāṣahaṃ rayiṃ sahasva ā bhara |
Translation: 2 Victorious Agni, bring to us the wealth that vanquisheth in war;

Sanskit Text: तवं हि सत्यो अद्भुतो दाता वाजस्य गोमतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hi satyo adbhuto dātā vājasya ghomataḥ ||
Translation: For thou art wonderful and true, giver of strength in herds of kine.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे हि तवा सजोषसो जनासो वर्क्तबर्हिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve hi tvā sajoṣaso janāso vṛktabarhiṣaḥ |
Translation: 3 For all the folk with one accord, whose sacred grass is trimmed and strewn,

Sanskit Text: होतारं सद्मसु परियं वयन्ति वार्या पुरु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotāraṃ sadmasu priyaṃ vyanti vāryā puru ||
Translation: Invite thee to their worship-halls, as a dear Priest, for choicest wealth.

Sanskit Text: स हि षमा विश्वचर्षणिर अभिमाति सहो दधे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi ṣmā viśvacarṣaṇir abhimāti saho dadhe |
Translation: 4 For he, the God of all men, hath gotten him might that quelleth foes.

Sanskit Text: अग्न एषु कषयेष्व आ रेवन नः शुक्र दीदिहि दयुमत पावक दीदिहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghna eṣu kṣayeṣv ā revan naḥ śukra dīdihi dyumat pāvaka dīdihi ||
Translation: O Agni, in these homes shine forth, bright God! for our prosperity, shine, Purifier! splendidly.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने तवं नो अन्तम उत तराता शिवो भवा वरूथ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne tvaṃ no antama uta trātā śivo bhavā varūthyaḥ |
Translation: 1. O AGNI, be our nearest Friend, be thou a kind deliverer and a gracious Friend.

Sanskit Text: वसुर अग्निर वसुश्रवा अछा नक्षि दयुमत्तमं रयिं दाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasur aghnir vasuśravā achā nakṣi dyumattamaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ |
Translation: 2 Excellent Agni, come thou nigh to us, and give us wealth most splendidly renowned.

Sanskit Text: स नो बोधि शरुधी हवम उरुष्या णो अघायतः समस्मात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no bodhi śrudhī havam uruṣyā ṇo aghāyataḥ samasmāt |
Translation: 3 So hear us, listen to this call of ours, and keep us far from every sinful man.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा शोचिष्ठ दीदिवः सुम्नाय नूनम ईमहे सखिभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā śociṣṭha dīdivaḥ sumnāya nūnam īmahe sakhibhyaḥ |
Translation: 4 To thee then, O Most Bright, O Radiant God, we come with prayer for happiness for our friends.

Sanskit Text: अछा वो अग्निम अवसे देवं गासि स नो वसुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā vo aghnim avase devaṃ ghāsi sa no vasuḥ |
Translation: 1. I WILL sing near, for grace, your God Agni, for he is good to us.

Sanskit Text: रासत पुत्र रषूणाम रतावा पर्षति दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāsat putra ṛṣūṇām ṛtāvā parṣati dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: Son of the Brands, may he give gifts, and, righteous, save us from the foe.

Sanskit Text: स हि सत्यो यम पूर्वे चिद देवासश चिद यम ईधिरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi satyo yam pūrve cid devāsaś cid yam īdhire |
Translation: 2 For he is true, whom men of old enkindled, and the Gods themselves,

Sanskit Text: होतारम मन्द्रजिह्वम इत सुदीतिभिर विभावसुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotāram mandrajihvam it sudītibhir vibhāvasum ||
Translation: The Priest with the delicious tongue, rich with the light of glorious beams.

Sanskit Text: स नो धीती वरिष्ठया शरेष्ठया च सुमत्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no dhītī variṣṭhayā śreṣṭhayā ca sumatyā |
Translation: 3 With wisdom that surpasseth all, with gracious will most excellent,

Sanskit Text: अग्ने रायो दिदीहि नः सुव्र्क्तिभिर वरेण्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne rāyo didīhi naḥ suvṛktibhir vareṇya ||
Translation: O Agni, worthy of our choice, shine wealth on us through hymns of praise.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर देवेषु राजत्य अग्निर मर्तेष्व आविशन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnir deveṣu rājaty aghnir marteṣv āviśan |
Translation: 4 Agni is King, for he extends to mortals and to Gods alike.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर नो हव्यवाहनो ऽगनिं धीभिः सपर्यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnir no havyavāhano 'ghniṃ dhībhiḥ saparyata ||
Translation: Agni is bearer of our gifts. Worship ye Agni with your thoughts.

Sanskit Text: अग्निस तुविश्रवस्तमं तुविब्रह्माणम उत्तमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnis tuviśravastamaṃ tuvibrahmāṇam uttamam |
Translation: 5 Agni gives to the worshipper a son, the best, of mightiest fame,

Sanskit Text: अतूर्तं शरावयत्पतिम पुत्रं ददाति दाशुषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atūrtaṃ śrāvayatpatim putraṃ dadāti dāśuṣe ||
Translation: Of deep devotion, ne’er subdued, bringer of glory to his sire.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर ददाति सत्पतिं सासाह यो युधा नर्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnir dadāti satpatiṃ sāsāha yo yudhā nṛbhiḥ |
Translation: 6 Agni bestows the hero-lord who conquers with the men in fight.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर अत्यं रघुष्यदं जेतारम अपराजितम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnir atyaṃ raghuṣyadaṃ jetāram aparājitam ||
Translation: Agni bestows the fleet-foot steed, the victor never overcome.

Sanskit Text: यद वाहिष्ठं तद अग्नये बर्हद अर्च विभावसो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vāhiṣṭhaṃ tad aghnaye bṛhad arca vibhāvaso |
Translation: 7 The mightiest song is Agni's: shine on high, thou who art rich in light.

Sanskit Text: महिषीव तवद रयिस तवद वाजा उद ईरते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahiṣīva tvad rayis tvad vājā ud īrate ||
Translation: Like the Chief Consort of a King, riches and strength proceed from thee.

Sanskit Text: तव दयुमन्तो अर्चयो गरावेवोच्यते बर्हत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava dyumanto arcayo ghrāvevocyate bṛhat |
Translation: 8 Resplendent are thy rays of light: loud is thy voice like pressing-stones.

Sanskit Text: उतो ते तन्यतुर यथा सवानो अर्त तमना दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto te tanyatur yathā svāno arta tmanā divaḥ ||
Translation: Yea, of itself thy thunder goes forth like the roaring of the heaven.

Sanskit Text: एवां अग्निं वसूयवः सहसानं ववन्दिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evāṃ aghniṃ vasūyavaḥ sahasānaṃ vavandima |
Translation: 9 Thus, seeking riches, have we paid homage to Agni Conqueror.

Sanskit Text: स नो विश्वा अति दविषः पर्षन नावेव सुक्रतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no viśvā ati dviṣaḥ parṣan nāveva sukratuḥ ||
Translation: May he, most wise, as with a ship, carry us over all our foes.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने पावक रोचिषा मन्द्रया देव जिह्वया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne pāvaka rociṣā mandrayā deva jihvayā |
Translation: 1. O AGNI, Holy and Divine, with splendour and thy pleasant tongue

Sanskit Text: आ देवान वक्षि यक्षि च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca ||
Translation: Bring hither and adore the Gods.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा घर्तस्नव ईमहे चित्रभानो सवर्द्र्शम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā ghṛtasnav īmahe citrabhāno svardṛśam |
Translation: 2 We pray thee, thou who droppest oil, bright-rayed! who lookest on the Sun,

Sanskit Text: देवां आ वीतये वह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāṃ ā vītaye vaha ||
Translation: Bring the Gods hither to the feast.

Sanskit Text: वीतिहोत्रं तवा कवे दयुमन्तं सम इधीमहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vītihotraṃ tvā kave dyumantaṃ sam idhīmahi |
Translation: 3 We have enkindled thee, O Sage, bright caller of the Gods to feast.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने बर्हन्तम अध्वरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne bṛhantam adhvare ||
Translation: O Agni, great in Sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने विश्वेभिर आ गहि देवेभिर हव्यदातये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne viśvebhir ā ghahi devebhir havyadātaye |
Translation: 4 O Agni, come with all the Gods, come to our sacrificial gift:

Sanskit Text: होतारं तवा वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotāraṃ tvā vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: We choose thee as Invoking Priest.

Sanskit Text: यजमानाय सुन्वत आग्ने सुवीर्यं वह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajamānāya sunvata āghne suvīryaṃ vaha |
Translation: 5 Bring, Agni, to the worshipper who pours the juice, heroic strength:

Sanskit Text: देवैर आ सत्सि बर्हिषि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devair ā satsi barhiṣi ||
Translation: Sit with the Gods upon the grass.

Sanskit Text: समिधानः सहस्रजिद अग्ने धर्माणि पुष्यसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samidhānaḥ sahasrajid aghne dharmāṇi puṣyasi |
Translation: 6 Victor of thousands, Agni, thou, enkindled, cherishest the laws,

Sanskit Text: देवानां दूत उक्थ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānāṃ dūta ukthyaḥ ||
Translation: Laud-worthy, envoy of the Gods.

Sanskit Text: नय अग्निं जातवेदसं होत्रवाहं यविष्ठ्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ny aghniṃ jātavedasaṃ hotravāhaṃ yaviṣṭhyam |
Translation: 7 Set Agni Jātavedas down, the bearer of our sacred gifts,

Sanskit Text: दधाता देवम रत्विजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhātā devam ṛtvijam ||
Translation: MostYouthful, God and Minister.

Sanskit Text: पर यज्ञ एत्व आनुषग अद्या देवव्यचस्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yajña etv ānuṣagh adyā devavyacastamaḥ |
Translation: 8 Duly proceed our sacrifice, comprising all the Gods, to-day:

Sanskit Text: सत्र्णीत बर्हिर आसदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stṛṇīta barhir āsade ||
Translation: Strew holy grass to be their seat.

Sanskit Text: एदम मरुतो अश्विना मित्रः सीदन्तु वरुणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: edam maruto aśvinā mitraḥ sīdantu varuṇaḥ |
Translation: 9 So may the Maruts sit thereon, the Aśvins, Mitra, Varuṇa:

Sanskit Text: देवासः सर्वया विशा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāsaḥ sarvayā viśā ||
Translation: The Gods with all their company.

Sanskit Text: अनस्वन्ता सत्पतिर मामहे मे गावा चेतिष्ठो असुरो मघोनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anasvantā satpatir māmahe me ghāvā cetiṣṭho asuro maghonaḥ |
Translation: 1. THE Godlike hero, famousest of nobles, hath granted me two oxen with a wagon.

Sanskit Text: तरैव्र्ष्णो अग्ने दशभिः सहस्रैर वैश्वानर तर्यरुणश चिकेत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: traivṛṣṇo aghne daśabhiḥ sahasrair vaiśvānara tryaruṇaś ciketa ||
Translation: Trvrsan's son Tryaruna hath distinguished himself, Vaiśvānara Agni! with ten thousands.

Sanskit Text: यो मे शता च विंशतिं च गोनां हरी च युक्ता सुधुरा ददाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo me śatā ca viṃśatiṃ ca ghonāṃ harī ca yuktā sudhurā dadāti |
Translation: 2 Protect Tryaruna, as thou art waxing strong and art highly praised, Vaiśvānara Agni!

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानर सुष्टुतो वाव्र्धानो ऽगने यछ तर्यरुणाय शर्म ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānara suṣṭuto vāvṛdhāno 'ghne yacha tryaruṇāya śarma ||
Translation: Who granteth me a hundred kine and twenty, and two bay horses, good at draught, and harnessed.

Sanskit Text: एवा ते अग्ने सुमतिं चकानो नविष्ठाय नवमं तरसदस्युः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā te aghne sumatiṃ cakāno naviṣṭhāya navamaṃ trasadasyuḥ |
Translation: 3 So Trasadasyu served thee, God Most Youthful, craving thy favour for the ninth time, Agni;

Sanskit Text: यो मे गिरस तुविजातस्य पूर्वीर युक्तेनाभि तर्यरुणो गर्णाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo me ghiras tuvijātasya pūrvīr yuktenābhi tryaruṇo ghṛṇāti ||
Translation: Tryaruya who with attentive spirit accepteth many a song from me the mighty.

Sanskit Text: यो म इति परवोचत्य अश्वमेधाय सूरये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo ma iti pravocaty aśvamedhāya sūraye |
Translation: 4 He who declares his wish to me, to Asvamedha, to the Prince,

Sanskit Text: ददद रचा सनिं यते ददन मेधाम रतायते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadad ṛcā saniṃ yate dadan medhām ṛtāyate ||
Translation: Pays him who with his verse seeks gain, gives power to him who keeps the Law.

Sanskit Text: यस्य मा परुषाः शतम उद्धर्षयन्त्य उक्षणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya mā paruṣāḥ śatam uddharṣayanty ukṣaṇaḥ |
Translation: 5 From whom a hundred oxen, all of speckled hue, delight my heart,

Sanskit Text: अश्वमेधस्य दानाः सोमा इव तर्य्र्शिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvamedhasya dānāḥ somā iva tryṛśiraḥ ||
Translation: The gifts of Asvamedha, like thrice-mingled draughts of Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी शतदाव्न्य अश्वमेधे सुवीर्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī śatadāvny aśvamedhe suvīryam |
Translation: 6 To Asvamedha who bestows a hundred gifts grant hero power,

Sanskit Text: कषत्रं धारयतम बर्हद दिवि सूर्यम इवाजरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣatraṃ dhārayatam bṛhad divi sūryam ivājaram ||
Translation: O Indra-Agni! lofty rule like the unwasting Sun in heaven.

Sanskit Text: समिद्धो अग्निर दिवि शोचिर अश्रेत परत्यङङ उषसम उर्विया वि भाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samiddho aghnir divi śocir aśret pratyaṅṅ uṣasam urviyā vi bhāti |
Translation: 1. AGNI inflamed hath sent to heaven his lustre: he shines forth widely turning unto Morning.

Sanskit Text: एति पराची विश्ववारा नमोभिर देवां ईळाना हविषा घर्ताची ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eti prācī viśvavārā namobhir devāṃ īḷānā haviṣā ghṛtācī ||
Translation: Eastward the ladle goes that brings all blessing, praising the Godswith homage and oblation.

Sanskit Text: समिध्यमानो अम्र्तस्य राजसि हविष कर्ण्वन्तं सचसे सवस्तये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samidhyamāno amṛtasya rājasi haviṣ kṛṇvantaṃ sacase svastaye |
Translation: 2 Enkindled, thou art King of the immortal world: him who brings offerings thou attendest for his weal.

Sanskit Text: विश्वं स धत्ते दरविणं यम इन्वस्य आतिथ्यम अग्ने नि च धत्त इत पुरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvaṃ sa dhatte draviṇaṃ yam invasy ātithyam aghne ni ca dhatta it puraḥ ||
Translation: He whom thou urgest on makes all possessions his: he sets before thee, Agni, gifts that guests may claim.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने शर्ध महते सौभगाय तव दयुम्नान्य उत्तमानि सन्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne śardha mahate saubhaghāya tava dyumnāny uttamāni santu |
Translation: 3 Show thyself strong for mighty bliss, O Agni, most excellent be thine effulgent splendours.

Sanskit Text: सं जास्पत्यं सुयमम आ कर्णुष्व शत्रूयताम अभि तिष्ठा महांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ jāspatyaṃ suyamam ā kṛṇuṣva śatrūyatām abhi tiṣṭhā mahāṃsi ||
Translation: Make easy to maintain our household lordship, and overcome the might of those who hate us.

Sanskit Text: समिद्धस्य परमहसो ऽगने वन्दे तव शरियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samiddhasya pramahaso 'ghne vande tava śriyam |
Translation: 4 Thy glory, Agni, I adore, kindled, exalted in thy strength.

Sanskit Text: वर्षभो दयुम्नवां असि सम अध्वरेष्व इध्यसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣabho dyumnavāṃ asi sam adhvareṣv idhyase ||
Translation: A Steer of brilliant splendour, thou art lighted well at sacred rites.

Sanskit Text: समिद्धो अग्न आहुत देवान यक्षि सवध्वर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samiddho aghna āhuta devān yakṣi svadhvara |
Translation: 5 Agni, invoked and kindled, serve the Gods, thou skilled in sacrifice:

Sanskit Text: तवं हि हव्यवाळ असि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hi havyavāḷ asi ||
Translation: For thou art bearer of our gifts.

Sanskit Text: आ जुहोता दुवस्यताग्निम परयत्य अध्वरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā juhotā duvasyatāghnim prayaty adhvare |
Translation: 6 Invoke and worship Agni while the sacrificial rite proceeds:

Sanskit Text: वर्णीध्वं हव्यवाहनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṇīdhvaṃ havyavāhanam ||
Translation: For offering-bearer choose ye him.

Sanskit Text: तर्य अर्यमा मनुषो देवताता तरी रोचना दिव्या धारयन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: try aryamā manuṣo devatātā trī rocanā divyā dhārayanta |
Translation: 1. MAN'S worship of the Gods hath three great lustres, and three celestial lights have they established

Sanskit Text: अर्चन्ति तवा मरुतः पूतदक्षास तवम एषाम रषिर इन्द्रासि धीरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arcanti tvā marutaḥ pūtadakṣās tvam eṣām ṛṣir indrāsi dhīraḥ ||
Translation: The Maruts gifted with pure strength adore thee, for thou, O Indra, art their sapient Ṛṣi.

Sanskit Text: अनु यद ईम मरुतो मन्दसानम आर्चन्न इन्द्रम पपिवांसं सुतस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu yad īm maruto mandasānam ārcann indram papivāṃsaṃ sutasya |
Translation: 2 What time the Maruts sang their song to Indra, joyous when he had drunk of Soma juices,

Sanskit Text: आदत्त वज्रम अभि यद अहिं हन्न अपो यह्वीर अस्र्जत सर्तवा उ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādatta vajram abhi yad ahiṃ hann apo yahvīr asṛjat sartavā u ||
Translation: He grasped his thunderbolt to slay the Dragon, and loosed, that they might flow, the youthful Waters.

Sanskit Text: उत बरह्माणो मरुतो मे अस्येन्द्रः सोमस्य सुषुतस्य पेयाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta brahmāṇo maruto me asyendraḥ somasya suṣutasya peyāḥ |
Translation: 3 And, O ye Brahmans, Maruts, so may Indra drink draughts of this my carefully pressed Soma;

Sanskit Text: तद धि हव्यम मनुषे गा अविन्दद अहन्न अहिम पपिवां इन्द्रो अस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad dhi havyam manuṣe ghā avindad ahann ahim papivāṃ indro asya ||
Translation: For this oblation found for man the cattle, and Indra, having quaffed it, slew the Dragon.

Sanskit Text: आद रोदसी वितरं वि षकभायत संविव्यानश चिद भियसे मर्गं कः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ād rodasī vitaraṃ vi ṣkabhāyat saṃvivyānaś cid bhiyase mṛghaṃ kaḥ |
Translation: 4 Then heaven and earth he sundered and supported: wrapped even in these he struck the Beast with terror.

Sanskit Text: जिगर्तिम इन्द्रो अपजर्गुराणः परति शवसन्तम अव दानवं हन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jighartim indro apajarghurāṇaḥ prati śvasantam ava dānavaṃ han ||
Translation: So Indra forced the Engulfer to disgorgement, and slew the Dānava. panting against him.

Sanskit Text: अध करत्वा मघवन तुभ्यं देवा अनु विश्वे अददुः सोमपेयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha kratvā maghavan tubhyaṃ devā anu viśve adaduḥ somapeyam |
Translation: 5 Thus all the Gods, O Maghavan, delivered to thee of their free will the draught of Soma;

Sanskit Text: यत सूर्यस्य हरितः पतन्तीः पुरः सतीर उपरा एतशे कः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat sūryasya haritaḥ patantīḥ puraḥ satīr uparā etaśe kaḥ ||
Translation: When thou for Etaśa didst cause to tarry the flying mares of Sūrya racing forward.

Sanskit Text: नव यद अस्य नवतिं च भोगान साकं वज्रेण मघवा विव्र्श्चत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nava yad asya navatiṃ ca bhoghān sākaṃ vajreṇa maghavā vivṛścat |
Translation: 6 When Maghavan with the thunderbolt demolished his nine-and-ninety castles all together,

Sanskit Text: अर्चन्तीन्द्रम मरुतः सधस्थे तरैष्टुभेन वचसा बाधत दयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arcantīndram marutaḥ sadhasthe traiṣṭubhena vacasā bādhata dyām ||
Translation: The Maruts, where they met, glorified Indra: ye with the Tṛṣṭup hymn obstructed heaven.

Sanskit Text: सखा सख्ये अपचत तूयम अग्निर अस्य करत्वा महिषा तरी शतानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhā sakhye apacat tūyam aghnir asya kratvā mahiṣā trī śatāni |
Translation: 7 As friend to aid a friend, Agni dressed quickly three hundred buffaloes, even as he willed it.

Sanskit Text: तरी साकम इन्द्रो मनुषः सरांसि सुतम पिबद वर्त्रहत्याय सोमम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trī sākam indro manuṣaḥ sarāṃsi sutam pibad vṛtrahatyāya somam ||
Translation: And Indra, from man's gift, for Vṛtra's slaughter, drank ofr at once three lakes of pressed-out Soma.

Sanskit Text: तरी यच छता महिषाणाम अघो मास तरी सरांसि मघवा सोम्यापाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trī yac chatā mahiṣāṇām agho mās trī sarāṃsi maghavā somyāpāḥ |
Translation: 8 When thou three hundred buffaloes' flesh hadst eaten, and drunk, as Maghavan, three lakes of Soma,

Sanskit Text: कारं न विश्वे अह्वन्त देवा भरम इन्द्राय यद अहिं जघान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kāraṃ na viśve ahvanta devā bharam indrāya yad ahiṃ jaghāna ||
Translation: All the Gods raised as ’twere a shout of triumph to Indra praise because he slew the Dragon.

Sanskit Text: उशना यत सहस्यैर अयातं गर्हम इन्द्र जूजुवानेभिर अश्वैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uśanā yat sahasyair ayātaṃ ghṛham indra jūjuvānebhir aśvaiḥ |
Translation: 9 What time ye came with strong steeds swiftly speeding, O Uśanā and Indra, to the dwelling,

Sanskit Text: वन्वानो अत्र सरथं ययाथ कुत्सेन देवैर अवनोर ह शुष्णम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanvāno atra sarathaṃ yayātha kutsena devair avanor ha śuṣṇam ||
Translation: Thou camest thither -conquering together with Kutsa and the Gods: thou slewest Śuṣṇa.

Sanskit Text: परान्यच चक्रम अव्र्हः सूर्यस्य कुत्सायान्यद वरिवो यातवे ऽकः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prānyac cakram avṛhaḥ sūryasya kutsāyānyad varivo yātave 'kaḥ |
Translation: 10 One car-wheel of the Sun thou rolledst forward, and one thou settest free to move for Kutsa.

Sanskit Text: अनासो दस्यूंर अम्र्णो वधेन नि दुर्योण आव्र्णङ मर्ध्रवाचः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anāso dasyūṃr amṛṇo vadhena ni duryoṇa āvṛṇaṅ mṛdhravācaḥ ||
Translation: Thou slewest noseless Dasyus with thy weapon, and in their home o’erthrewest hostile speakers.

Sanskit Text: सतोमासस तवा गौरिवीतेर अवर्धन्न अरन्धयो वैदथिनाय पिप्रुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stomāsas tvā ghaurivīter avardhann arandhayo vaidathināya piprum |
Translation: 11 The lauds of Gauriviti made thee mighty to Vidathin's son, as prey, thou gavest Pipru.

Sanskit Text: आ तवाम रजिश्वा सख्याय चक्रे पचन पक्तीर अपिबः सोमम अस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tvām ṛjiśvā sakhyāya cakre pacan paktīr apibaḥ somam asya ||
Translation: Rjisivan drew thee into friendship dressing the sacred food, and thou hast drunk his Soma.

Sanskit Text: नवग्वासः सुतसोमास इन्द्रं दशग्वासो अभ्य अर्चन्त्य अर्कैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: navaghvāsaḥ sutasomāsa indraṃ daśaghvāso abhy arcanty arkaiḥ |
Translation: 12 Navagvas and Dasgvas with libations of Soma juice sing hymns of praise to Indra.

Sanskit Text: गव्यं चिद ऊर्वम अपिधानवन्तं तं चिन नरः शशमाना अप वरन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghavyaṃ cid ūrvam apidhānavantaṃ taṃ cin naraḥ śaśamānā apa vran ||
Translation: Labouring at their task the men laid open the stall of Kine though firmly closed and fastened.

Sanskit Text: कथो नु ते परि चराणि विद्वान वीर्य्र मघवन या चकर्थ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: katho nu te pari carāṇi vidvān vīryṛ maghavan yā cakartha |
Translation: 13 How shall I serve thee, Maghavan, though knowing full well what hero deeds thou hast accomplished?

Sanskit Text: या चो नु नव्या कर्णवः शविष्ठ परेद उ ता ते विदथेषु बरवाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā co nu navyā kṛṇavaḥ śaviṣṭha pred u tā te vidatheṣu bravāma ||
Translation: And the fresh deeds which thou wilt do, Most Mighty! these, too, will we tell forth in sacred synods.

Sanskit Text: एता विश्वा चक्र्वां इन्द्र भूर्य अपरीतो जनुषा वीर्येण |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etā viśvā cakṛvāṃ indra bhūry aparīto januṣā vīryeṇa |
Translation: 14 Resistless from of old through hero courage, thou hast done all these many acts, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: या चिन नु वज्रिन कर्णवो दध्र्ष्वान न ते वर्ता तविष्या अस्ति तस्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā cin nu vajrin kṛṇavo dadhṛṣvān na te vartā taviṣyā asti tasyāḥ ||
Translation: What thou wilt do in bravery, Thunder-wielder! none is there who may hinder this thy prowess.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र बरह्म करियमाणा जुषस्व या ते शविष्ठ नव्या अकर्म |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra brahma kriyamāṇā juṣasva yā te śaviṣṭha navyā akarma |
Translation: 15 Indra, accept the prayers which now are offered, accept the new prayers, Mightiest! which we utter.

Sanskit Text: वस्त्रेव भद्रा सुक्र्ता वसूयू रथं न धीरः सवपा अतक्षम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vastreva bhadrā sukṛtā vasūyū rathaṃ na dhīraḥ svapā atakṣam ||
Translation: Like fair and well-made robes, I, seeking riches, as a deft craftsman makes a car, have wrought them.

Sanskit Text: कव सय वीरः को अपश्यद इन्द्रं सुखरथम ईयमानं हरिभ्याम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kva sya vīraḥ ko apaśyad indraṃ sukharatham īyamānaṃ haribhyām |
Translation: 1. WHERE is that Hero? Who hath looked on Indra borne on light-rolling car by Tawny Coursers,

Sanskit Text: यो राया वज्री सुतसोमम इछन तद ओको गन्ता पुरुहूत ऊती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo rāyā vajrī sutasomam ichan tad oko ghantā puruhūta ūtī ||
Translation: Who, Thunderer, seeks with wealth the Soma-presser, and to his house goes, much-invoked, to aid him?

Sanskit Text: अवाचचक्षम पदम अस्य सस्वर उग्रं निधातुर अन्व आयम इछन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avācacakṣam padam asya sasvar ughraṃ nidhātur anv āyam ichan |
Translation: 2 I have beheld his strong and secret dwelling, longing have sought the Founder's habitation.

Sanskit Text: अप्र्छम अन्यां उत ते म आहुर इन्द्रं नरो बुबुधाना अशेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apṛcham anyāṃ uta te ma āhur indraṃ naro bubudhānā aśema ||
Translation: I asked of others, and they said in answer, May we, awakened men, attain to Indra.

Sanskit Text: पर नु वयं सुते या ते कर्तानीन्द्र बरवाम यानि नो जुजोषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra nu vayaṃ sute yā te kṛtānīndra bravāma yāni no jujoṣaḥ |
Translation: 3 We will tell, Indra, when we pour libation, what mighty deeds thou hast performed to please us.

Sanskit Text: वेदद अविद्वाञ छर्णवच च विद्वान वहते ऽयम मघवा सर्वसेनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vedad avidvāñ chṛṇavac ca vidvān vahate 'yam maghavā sarvasenaḥ ||
Translation: Let him who knows not learn, who knows them listen: hither rides Maghavan with all his army.

Sanskit Text: सथिरम मनश चक्र्षे जात इन्द्र वेषीद एको युधये भूयसश चित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sthiram manaś cakṛṣe jāta indra veṣīd eko yudhaye bhūyasaś cit |
Translation: 4 Indra, when born, thou madest firm thy spirit: alone thou seekest war to fight with many.

Sanskit Text: अश्मानं चिच छवसा दिद्युतो वि विदो गवाम ऊर्वम उस्रियाणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśmānaṃ cic chavasā didyuto vi vido ghavām ūrvam usriyāṇām ||
Translation: With might thou clavest e’en the rock asunder, and foundest out the stable of the Milch-kine.

Sanskit Text: परो यत तवम परम आजनिष्ठाः परावति शरुत्यं नाम बिभ्रत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: paro yat tvam parama ājaniṣṭhāḥ parāvati śrutyaṃ nāma bibhrat |
Translation: 5 When thou wast born supremest at a distance, bearing a name renowned in far-off regions,

Sanskit Text: अतश चिद इन्द्राद अभयन्त देवा विश्वा अपो अजयद दासपत्नीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ataś cid indrād abhayanta devā viśvā apo ajayad dāsapatnīḥ ||
Translation: Since then e’en Gods have been afraid of Indra: he conquered all the floods which served the Dāsa.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्येद एते मरुतः सुशेवा अर्चन्त्य अर्कं सुन्वन्त्य अन्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyed ete marutaḥ suśevā arcanty arkaṃ sunvanty andhaḥ |
Translation: 6 These blissful Maruts sing their psalm to praise thee, and pour to thee libation of the Soma.

Sanskit Text: अहिम ओहानम अप आशयानम पर मायाभिर मायिनं सक्षद इन्द्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahim ohānam apa āśayānam pra māyābhir māyinaṃ sakṣad indraḥ ||
Translation: Indra with wondrous powers subdued the Dragon, the guileful lurker who beset the waters.

Sanskit Text: वि षू मर्धो जनुषा दानम इन्वन्न अहन गवा मघवन संचकानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi ṣū mṛdho januṣā dānam invann ahan ghavā maghavan saṃcakānaḥ |
Translation: 7 Thou, Maghavan, from the first didst scatter foemen, speeding, while joying in the milk, the Giver.

Sanskit Text: अत्रा दासस्य नमुचेः शिरो यद अवर्तयो मनवे गातुम इछन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrā dāsasya namuceḥ śiro yad avartayo manave ghātum ichan ||
Translation: There, seeking man's prosperity, thou torest away the head of Namuci the Dāsa.

Sanskit Text: युजं हि माम अक्र्था आद इद इन्द्र शिरो दासस्य नमुचेर मथायन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yujaṃ hi mām akṛthā ād id indra śiro dāsasya namucer mathāyan |
Translation: 8 Pounding the head of Namuci the Dāsa, me, too thou madest thine associate, Indra!

Sanskit Text: अश्मानं चित सवर्यं वर्तमानम पर चक्रियेव रोदसी मरुद्भ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśmānaṃ cit svaryaṃ vartamānam pra cakriyeva rodasī marudbhyaḥ ||
Translation: Yea, and the rolling stone that is in heaven both worlds, as on a car, brought to the Maruts.

Sanskit Text: सत्रियो हि दास आयुधानि चक्रे किम मा करन्न अबला अस्य सेनाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: striyo hi dāsa āyudhāni cakre kim mā karann abalā asya senāḥ |
Translation: 9 Women for weapons hath the Dāsa taken, What injury can his feeble armies To me?

Sanskit Text: अन्तर हय अख्यद उभे अस्य धेने अथोप परैद युधये दस्युम इन्द्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: antar hy akhyad ubhe asya dhene athopa praid yudhaye dasyum indraḥ ||
Translation: Well he distinguished his two different voices, and Indra then advanced to fight the Dasyu.

Sanskit Text: सम अत्र गावो ऽभितो ऽनवन्तेहेह वत्सैर वियुता यद आसन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sam atra ghāvo 'bhito 'navanteheha vatsair viyutā yad āsan |
Translation: 10 Divided from their calves the Cows went lowing around, on every side, hither and thither.

Sanskit Text: सं ता इन्द्रो अस्र्जद अस्य शाकैर यद ईं सोमासः सुषुता अमन्दन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ tā indro asṛjad asya śākair yad īṃ somāsaḥ suṣutā amandan ||
Translation: These Indra re-united with his helpers, what time the well-pressed Soma made him joyful.

Sanskit Text: यद ईं सोमा बभ्रुधूता अमन्दन्न अरोरवीद वर्षभः सादनेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad īṃ somā babhrudhūtā amandann aroravīd vṛṣabhaḥ sādaneṣu |
Translation: 11 What time the Somas mixed by Babhru cheered him, loud the Steer bellowed in his habitations.

Sanskit Text: पुरंदरः पपिवां इन्द्रो अस्य पुनर गवाम अददाद उस्रियाणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: puraṃdaraḥ papivāṃ indro asya punar ghavām adadād usriyāṇām ||
Translation: So Indra drank thereof, the Fort-destroyer, and gave him guerdon, in return, of milch-kine.

Sanskit Text: भद्रम इदं रुशमा अग्ने अक्रन गवां चत्वारि ददतः सहस्रा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadram idaṃ ruśamā aghne akran ghavāṃ catvāri dadataḥ sahasrā |
Translation: 12 This good deed have the Rusamas done, Agni! that they have granted me four thousand cattle.

Sanskit Text: रणंचयस्य परयता मघानि परत्य अग्रभीष्म नर्तमस्य नर्णाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṇaṃcayasya prayatā maghāni praty aghrabhīṣma nṛtamasya nṛṇām ||
Translation: We have received Rnancaya's wealth, of heroes the most heroic, which was freely offered.

Sanskit Text: सुपेशसम माव सर्जन्त्य अस्तं गवां सहस्रै रुशमासो अग्ने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: supeśasam māva sṛjanty astaṃ ghavāṃ sahasrai ruśamāso aghne |
Translation: 13 The Rusamas, O Agni, sent me homeward with fair adornment and with kine in thousands.

Sanskit Text: तीव्रा इन्द्रम अममन्दुः सुतासो ऽकतोर वयुष्टौ परितक्म्यायाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tīvrā indram amamanduḥ sutāso 'ktor vyuṣṭau paritakmyāyāḥ ||
Translation: The strong libations have made Indra joyful, when night, whose course was ending, changed to morning.

Sanskit Text: औछत सा रात्री परितक्म्या यां रणंचये राजनि रुशमानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: auchat sā rātrī paritakmyā yāṃ ṛṇaṃcaye rājani ruśamānām |
Translation: 14 Night, well-nigh ended, at Rnancaya's coming, King of the Rusamas, was changed to morning.

Sanskit Text: अत्यो न वाजी रघुर अज्यमानो बभ्रुश चत्वार्य असनत सहस्रा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atyo na vājī raghur ajyamāno babhruś catvāry asanat sahasrā ||
Translation: Like a strong courser, fleet of foot, urged onward, Babhru hath gained four thousand as his guerdon.

Sanskit Text: चतुःसहस्रं गव्यस्य पश्वः परत्य अग्रभीष्म रुशमेष्व अग्ने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: catuḥsahasraṃ ghavyasya paśvaḥ praty aghrabhīṣma ruśameṣv aghne |
Translation: 15 We have received four thousand head of cattle presented by the Rusamas, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: घर्मश चित तप्तः परव्र्जे य आसीद अयस्मयस तं व आदाम विप्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: gharmaś cit taptaḥ pravṛje ya āsīd ayasmayas taṃ v ādāma viprāḥ ||
Translation: And we, the singers, have received the caldron of metal which was heated for Pravargya.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो रथाय परवतं कर्णोति यम अध्यस्थान मघवा वाजयन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro rathāya pravataṃ kṛṇoti yam adhyasthān maghavā vājayantam |
Translation: 1. MAGHAVAN Indra turns his chariot downward, the strength-displaying car which he hath mounted.

Sanskit Text: यूथेव पश्वो वय उनोति गोपा अरिष्टो याति परथमः सिषासन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūtheva paśvo vy unoti ghopā aṛiṣṭo yāti prathamaḥ siṣāsan ||
Translation: Even as a herdsman driveth forth his cattle, he goeth, first, uninjured, fain for treasure.

Sanskit Text: आ पर दरव हरिवो मा वि वेनः पिशङगराते अभि नः सचस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā pra drava harivo mā vi venaḥ piśaṅgharāte abhi naḥ sacasva |
Translation: 2. Haste to us, Lord of Bays; be not ungracious: visit us, lover of gold-hued oblation.

Sanskit Text: नहि तवद इन्द्र वस्यो अन्यद अस्त्य अमेनांश चिज जनिवतश चकर्थ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi tvad indra vasyo anyad asty amenāṃś cij janivataś cakartha ||
Translation: There is naught else better than thou art, Indra: e’en to the wifeless hast thou given spouses.

Sanskit Text: उद यत सहः सहस आजनिष्ट देदिष्ट इन्द्र इन्द्रियाणि विश्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud yat sahaḥ sahasa ājaniṣṭa dediṣṭa indra indriyāṇi viśvā |
Translation: 3 When out of strength arose the strength that conquers, Indra displayed all powers that he possesses.

Sanskit Text: पराचोदयत सुदुघा वव्रे अन्तर वि जयोतिषा संवव्र्त्वत तमो ऽवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prācodayat sudughā vavre antar vi jyotiṣā saṃvavṛtvat tamo 'vaḥ ||
Translation: Forth from the cave he drove the milky mothers, and with the light laid bare investing darkness.

Sanskit Text: अनवस ते रथम अश्वाय तक्षन तवष्टा वज्रम पुरुहूत दयुमन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anavas te ratham aśvāya takṣan tvaṣṭā vajram puruhūta dyumantam |
Translation: 4. Anus have wrought a chariot for thy Courser, and Tvaṣṭar, Much-invoked! thy bolt that glitters.

Sanskit Text: बरह्माण इन्द्रम महयन्तो अर्कैर अवर्धयन्न अहये हन्तवा उ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmāṇa indram mahayanto arkair avardhayann ahaye hantavā u ||
Translation: The Brahmans with their songs exalting Indra increased his strength that he might slaughter Ahi.

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्णे यत ते वर्षणो अर्कम अर्चान इन्द्र गरावाणो अदितिः सजोषाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṇe yat te vṛṣaṇo arkam arcān indra ghrāvāṇo aditiḥ sajoṣāḥ |
Translation: 5 When heroes sang their laud to thee the Hero, Indra! and stones and Aditi accordant,

Sanskit Text: अनश्वासो ये पवयो ऽरथा इन्द्रेषिता अभ्य अवर्तन्त दस्यून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anaśvāso ye pavayo 'rathā indreṣitā abhy avartanta dasyūn ||
Translation: Without or steed or chariot were the fellies which, sped by Indra, rolled upon the Dasytis.

Sanskit Text: पर ते पूर्वाणि करणानि वोचम पर नूतना मघवन या चकर्थ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te pūrvāṇi karaṇāni vocam pra nūtanā maghavan yā cakartha |
Translation: 6 I will declare thine exploits wrought aforetime, and, Maghavan, thy deeds of late achievement,

Sanskit Text: शक्तीवो यद विभरा रोदसी उभे जयन्न अपो मनवे दानुचित्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaktīvo yad vibharā rodasī ubhe jayann apo manave dānucitrāḥ ||
Translation: When, Lord of Might, thou sunderedst earth and heaven, winning for man the moistly-gleaming waters.

Sanskit Text: तद इन नु ते करणं दस्म विप्राहिं यद घनन्न ओजो अत्रामिमीथाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad in nu te karaṇaṃ dasma viprāhiṃ yad ghnann ojo atrāmimīthāḥ |
Translation: 7 This is thy deed, e’en this, Wonderful! Singer! that, slaying Ahi, here thy strength thou showedst,

Sanskit Text: शुष्णस्य चित परि माया अग्र्भ्णाः परपित्वं यन्न अप दस्यूंर असेधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuṣṇasya cit pari māyā aghṛbhṇāḥ prapitvaṃ yann apa dasyūṃr asedhaḥ ||
Translation: Didst check and stay e’en gusna's wiles and magic, and, drawing nigh, didst chase away the Dasytis.

Sanskit Text: तवम अपो यदवे तुर्वशायारमयः सुदुघाः पार इन्द्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvam apo yadave turvaśāyāramayaḥ sudughāḥ pāra indra |
Translation: 8 Thou, Indra, on the farther bank forYadu and Turvaga didst stay the gushing waters.

Sanskit Text: उग्रम अयातम अवहो ह कुत्सं सं ह यद वाम उशनारन्त देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughram ayātam avaho ha kutsaṃ saṃ ha yad vām uśanāranta devāḥ ||
Translation: Ye both assailed the fierce: thou barest Kutsa: when Gods and Uśanā came to you together.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राकुत्सा वहमाना रथेना वाम अत्या अपि कर्णे वहन्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrākutsā vahamānā rathenā vām atyā api karṇe vahantu |
Translation: 9 Let the steeds bring you both, Indra and Kutsa, borne on the chariot within hearing-distance.

Sanskit Text: निः षीम अद्भ्यो धमथो निः षधस्थान मघोनो हर्दो वरथस तमांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niḥ ṣīm adbhyo dhamatho niḥ ṣadhasthān maghono hṛdo varathas tamāṃsi ||
Translation: Ye blew him from the waters, from his dwelling, and chased the darkness from the noble's spirit.

Sanskit Text: वातस्य युक्तान सुयुजश चिद अश्वान कविश चिद एषो अजगन्न अवस्युः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vātasya yuktān suyujaś cid aśvān kaviś cid eṣo ajaghann avasyuḥ |
Translation: 10 Even this sage hath come looking for succour even to Vāta's docile harnessed horses.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे ते अत्र मरुतः सखाय इन्द्र बरह्माणि तविषीम अवर्धन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve te atra marutaḥ sakhāya indra brahmāṇi taviṣīm avardhan ||
Translation: Here are the Maruts, all, thy dear companions: prayers have increased thy power and might, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: सूरश चिद रथम परितक्म्यायाम पूर्वं करद उपरं जूजुवांसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūraś cid ratham paritakmyāyām pūrvaṃ karad uparaṃ jūjuvāṃsam |
Translation: 11 When night was near its close he carried forward e’en the Sun's chariot backward in its running.

Sanskit Text: भरच चक्रम एतशः सं रिणाति पुरो दधत सनिष्यति करतुं नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharac cakram etaśaḥ saṃ riṇāti puro dadhat saniṣyati kratuṃ naḥ ||
Translation: Etaga brought his wheel and firmly stays it: setting it eastward he shall give us courage.

Sanskit Text: आयं जना अभिचक्षे जगामेन्द्रः सखायं सुतसोमम इछन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āyaṃ janā abhicakṣe jaghāmendraḥ sakhāyaṃ sutasomam ichan |
Translation: 12 This Indra, O ye men, hath come to see you, seeking a friend who hath expressed the Soma.

Sanskit Text: वदन गरावाव वेदिम भरियाते यस्य जीरम अध्वर्यवश चरन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vadan ghrāvāva vedim bhriyāte yasya jīram adhvaryavaś caranti ||
Translation: The creaking stone is laid upon the altar, and the Adhvaryus come to turn it quickly.

Sanskit Text: ये चाकनन्त चाकनन्त नू ते मर्ता अम्र्त मो ते अंह आरन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye cākananta cākananta nū te martā amṛta mo te aṃha āran |
Translation: 13 Let mortals who were happy still be happy; let them not come to sorrow, O Immortal.

Sanskit Text: वावन्धि यज्यूंर उत तेषु धेह्य ओजो जनेषु येषु ते सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāvandhi yajyūṃr uta teṣu dhehy ojo janeṣu yeṣu te syāma ||
Translation: Love thou the pious, and to these thy people-with whom may we be numbered-give thou vigour.

Sanskit Text: अजातशत्रुम अजरा सवर्वत्य अनु सवधामिता दस्मम ईयते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajātaśatrum ajarā svarvaty anu svadhāmitā dasmam īyate |
Translation: 1. BOUNDLESS and wasting not, the heavenly food of Gods goes to the foeless One, doer of wondrous deeds.

Sanskit Text: सुनोतन पचत बरह्मवाहसे पुरुष्टुताय परतरं दधातन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sunotana pacata brahmavāhase puruṣṭutāya prataraṃ dadhātana ||
Translation: Press out, make ready, offer gifts with special zeal to him whom many laud, accepter of the prayer.

Sanskit Text: आ यः सोमेन जठरम अपिप्रतामन्दत मघवा मध्वो अन्धसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yaḥ somena jaṭharam apipratāmandata maghavā madhvo andhasaḥ |
Translation: 2 He who filled full his belly with the Soma's juice, Maghavan, was delighted with the meath's sweet draught,

Sanskit Text: यद ईम मर्गाय हन्तवे महावधः सहस्रभ्र्ष्टिम उशना वधं यमत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad īm mṛghāya hantave mahāvadhaḥ sahasrabhṛṣṭim uśanā vadhaṃ yamat ||
Translation: When Uśanā, that he might slay the monstrous beast, gave him the mighty weapon with a thousand points.

Sanskit Text: यो अस्मै घरंस उत वा य ऊधनि सोमं सुनोति भवति दयुमां अह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo asmai ghraṃsa uta vā ya ūdhani somaṃ sunoti bhavati dyumāṃ aha |
Translation: 3 Illustrious is the man whoever presseth out Soma for him in sunshine or in cloud and rain.

Sanskit Text: अपाप शक्रस ततनुष्टिम ऊहति तनूशुभ्रम मघवा यः कवासखः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāpa śakras tatanuṣṭim ūhati tanūśubhram maghavā yaḥ kavāsakhaḥ ||
Translation: The mighty Maghavan who is the sage's Friend advanceth more and more his beauteous progeny.

Sanskit Text: यस्यावधीत पितरं यस्य मातरं यस्य शक्रो भरातरं नात ईषते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasyāvadhīt pitaraṃ yasya mātaraṃ yasya śakro bhrātaraṃ nāta īṣate |
Translation: 4 The Strong God doth not flee away from him whose sire, whose mother or whose brother he hath done to death.

Sanskit Text: वेतीद व अस्य परयता यतंकरो न किल्बिषाद ईषते वस्व आकरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vetīd v asya prayatā yataṃkaro na kilbiṣād īṣate vasva ākaraḥ ||
Translation: He, the Avenger, seeketh this man's offered gifts: this God, the source of riches, doth not flee from sin.

Sanskit Text: न पञ्चभिर दशभिर वष्ट्य आरभं नासुन्वता सचते पुष्यता चन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na pañcabhir daśabhir vaṣṭy ārabhaṃ nāsunvatā sacate puṣyatā cana |
Translation: 5 He seeks no enterprise with five or ten to aid, nor stays with him who pours no juice though prospering well.

Sanskit Text: जिनाति वेद अमुया हन्ति वा धुनिर आ देवयुम भजति गोमति वरजे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jināti ved amuyā hanti vā dhunir ā devayum bhajati ghomati vraje ||
Translation: The Shaker conquers or slays in this way or that, and to the pious gives a stable full of kine.

Sanskit Text: वित्वक्षणः सम्र्तौ चक्रमासजो ऽसुन्वतो विषुणः सुन्वतो वर्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vitvakṣaṇaḥ samṛtau cakramāsajo 'sunvato viṣuṇaḥ sunvato vṛdhaḥ |
Translation: 6 Exceeding strong in war he stays the chariot wheel, and, hating him who pours not, prospers him who pours.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो विश्वस्य दमिता विभीषणो यथावशं नयति दासम आर्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro viśvasya damitā vibhīṣaṇo yathāvaśaṃ nayati dāsam āryaḥ ||
Translation: Indra the terrible, tamer of every man, as Ārya leads away the Dāsa at his will.

Sanskit Text: सम ईम पणेर अजति भोजनम मुषे वि दाशुषे भजति सूनरं वसु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sam īm paṇer ajati bhojanam muṣe vi dāśuṣe bhajati sūnaraṃ vasu |
Translation: 7 He gathers up for plunder all the niggard’s gear: excellent wealth he gives to him who offers gifts.

Sanskit Text: दुर्गे चन धरियते विश्व आ पुरु जनो यो अस्य तविषीम अचुक्रुधत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: durghe cana dhriyate viśva ā puru jano yo asya taviṣīm acukrudhat ||
Translation: Not even in wide stronghold may all the folk stand firm who have provoked to anger his surpassing might.

Sanskit Text: सं यज जनौ सुधनौ विश्वशर्धसाव अवेद इन्द्रो मघवा गोषु शुभ्रिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yaj janau sudhanau viśvaśardhasāv aved indro maghavā ghoṣu śubhriṣu |
Translation: 8 When Indra Maghavan hath marked two wealthy men fighting for beauteous cows with all their followers,

Sanskit Text: युजं हय अन्यम अक्र्त परवेपन्य उद ईं गव्यं सर्जते सत्वभिर धुनिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yujaṃ hy anyam akṛta pravepany ud īṃ ghavyaṃ sṛjate satvabhir dhuniḥ ||
Translation: He who stirs all things takes one as his close ally, and, Shaker, with his Heroes, sends the kine to him.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रसाम आग्निवेशिं गर्णीषे शत्रिम अग्न उपमां केतुम अर्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasrasām āghniveśiṃ ghṛṇīṣe śatrim aghna upamāṃ ketum aryaḥ |
Translation: 9 Agni! I laud the liberal Agnivesi, Satri the type and standard of the pious.

Sanskit Text: तस्मा आपः संयतः पीपयन्त तस्मिन कषत्रम अमवत तवेषम अस्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmā āpaḥ saṃyataḥ pīpayanta tasmin kṣatram amavat tveṣam astu ||
Translation: May the collected waters yield him plenty, and his be powerful and bright dominion.

Sanskit Text: यस ते साधिष्ठो ऽवस इन्द्र करतुष टम आ भर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yas te sādhiṣṭho 'vasa indra kratuṣ ṭam ā bhara |
Translation: 1. INDRA, for our assistance bring that most effectual power of thine,

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं चर्षणीसहं सस्निं वाजेषु दुष्टरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ carṣaṇīsahaṃ sasniṃ vājeṣu duṣṭaram ||
Translation: Which conquers men for us, and wins the spoil, invincible in fight.

Sanskit Text: यद इन्द्र ते चतस्रो यच छूर सन्ति तिस्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad indra te catasro yac chūra santi tisraḥ |
Translation: 2 Indra, whatever aids be thine, four be they, or, O Hero, three,

Sanskit Text: यद वा पञ्च कषितीनाम अवस तत सु न आ भर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā pañca kṣitīnām avas tat su na ā bhara ||
Translation: Or those of the Five Tribes of men, bring quickly all that help to us.

Sanskit Text: आ ते ऽवो वरेण्यं वर्षन्तमस्य हूमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā te 'vo vareṇyaṃ vṛṣantamasya hūmahe |
Translation: 3 The aid most excellent of thee the Mightiest hitherward we call,

Sanskit Text: वर्षजूतिर हि जज्ञिष आभूभिर इन्द्र तुर्वणिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣajūtir hi jajñiṣa ābhūbhir indra turvaṇiḥ ||
Translation: For thou wast born with hero might, conquering, Indra, with the Strong.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा हय असि राधसे जज्ञिषे वर्ष्णि ते शवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā hy asi rādhase jajñiṣe vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ |
Translation: 4 Mighty to prosper us wast thou born, and mighty is the strength thou hast.

Sanskit Text: सवक्षत्रं ते धर्षन मनः सत्राहम इन्द्र पौंस्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svakṣatraṃ te dhṛṣan manaḥ satrāham indra pauṃsyam ||
Translation: In native power thy soul is firm: thy valour, Indra, slays a host.

Sanskit Text: तवं तम इन्द्र मर्त्यम अमित्रयन्तम अद्रिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tam indra martyam amitrayantam adrivaḥ |
Translation: 5 O Śatakratu, Lord of Strength, O Indra, Caster of the Stone.

Sanskit Text: सर्वरथा शतक्रतो नि याहि शवसस पते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarvarathā śatakrato ni yāhi śavasas pate ||
Translation: With all thy chariot's force assail the man who shows himself thy foe.

Sanskit Text: तवाम इद वर्त्रहन्तम जनासो वर्क्तबर्हिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvām id vṛtrahantama janāso vṛktabarhiṣaḥ |
Translation: 6 For, Mightiest Vṛtra-slayer, thee, fierce, foremost among many, folk

Sanskit Text: उग्रम पूर्वीषु पूर्व्यं हवन्ते वाजसातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughram pūrvīṣu pūrvyaṃ havante vājasātaye ||
Translation: Whose sacred grass is trimmed invite to battle where the spoil is won.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकम इन्द्र दुष्टरम पुरोयावानम आजिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākam indra duṣṭaram puroyāvānam ājiṣu |
Translation: 7 Indra, do thou protect our car that mingles foremost in the fights,

Sanskit Text: सयावानं धने-धने वाजयन्तम अवा रथम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sayāvānaṃ dhane-dhane vājayantam avā ratham ||
Translation: That bears its part in every fray, invincible and seeking spoil.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकम इन्द्रेहि नो रथम अवा पुरंध्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākam indrehi no ratham avā puraṃdhyā |
Translation: 8 Come to us, Indra, and protect our car with thine intelligence.

Sanskit Text: वयं शविष्ठ वार्यं दिवि शरवो दधीमहि दिवि सतोमम मनामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ śaviṣṭha vāryaṃ divi śravo dadhīmahi divi stomam manāmahe ||
Translation: May we, O Mightiest One, obtain excellent fame at break of day, and meditate our hymn at dawn.

Sanskit Text: स आ गमद इन्द्रो यो वसूनां चिकेतद दातुं दामनो रयीणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ā ghamad indro yo vasūnāṃ ciketad dātuṃ dāmano rayīṇām |
Translation: 1. MAY Indra come to us, he who knows rightly to give forth treasures from his store of riches.

Sanskit Text: धन्वचरो न वंसगस तर्षाणश चकमानः पिबतु दुग्धम अंशुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhanvacaro na vaṃsaghas tṛṣāṇaś cakamānaḥ pibatu dughdham aṃśum ||
Translation: Even as a thirsty steer who roams the deserts may he drink eagerly the milked-out Soma.

Sanskit Text: आ ते हनू हरिवः शूर शिप्रे रुहत सोमो न पर्वतस्य पर्ष्ठे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā te hanū harivaḥ śūra śipre ruhat somo na parvatasya pṛṣṭhe |
Translation: 2 Lord of Bay Horses, Hero, may the Soma rise to thy cheeks and jaws like mountain-ridges.

Sanskit Text: अनु तवा राजन्न अर्वतो न हिन्वन गीर्भिर मदेम पुरुहूत विश्वे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu tvā rājann arvato na hinvan ghīrbhir madema puruhūta viśve ||
Translation: May we, O King, as he who driveth coursers, all joy in thee with hymns, invoked of many!

Sanskit Text: चक्रं न वर्त्तम पुरुहूत वेपते मनो भिया मे अमतेर इद अद्रिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakraṃ na vṛttam puruhūta vepate mano bhiyā me amater id adrivaḥ |
Translation: 3 Invoked of many, Caster of the Stone my heart quakes like a rolling wheel for fear of penury.

Sanskit Text: रथाद अधि तवा जरिता सदाव्र्ध कुविन नु सतोषन मघवन पुरूवसुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathād adhi tvā jaritā sadāvṛdha kuvin nu stoṣan maghavan purūvasuḥ ||
Translation: Shall not Puruvasu the singer give thee praise, O ever-prospering Maghavan, mounted on thy car?

Sanskit Text: एष गरावेव जरिता त इन्द्रेयर्ति वाचम बर्हद आशुषाणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa ghrāveva jaritā ta indreyarti vācam bṛhad āśuṣāṇaḥ |
Translation: 4 Like the press-stone is this thy praiser, Indra. Loudly he lifts his voice with strong endeavour.

Sanskit Text: पर सव्येन मघवन यंसि रायः पर दक्षिणिद धरिवो मा वि वेनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra savyena maghavan yaṃsi rāyaḥ pra dakṣiṇid dharivo mā vi venaḥ ||
Translation: With thy left hand, O Maghavan, give us riches: with thy right, Lord of Bays, be not reluctant.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा तवा वर्षणं वर्धतु दयौर वर्षा वर्षभ्यां वहसे हरिभ्याम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇaṃ vardhatu dyaur vṛṣā vṛṣabhyāṃ vahase haribhyām |
Translation: 5 May the strong Heaven make thee the Strong wax stronger: Strong, thou art borne by thy two strong Bay Horses.

Sanskit Text: स नो वर्षा वर्षरथः सुशिप्र वर्षक्रतो वर्षा वज्रिन भरे धाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no vṛṣā vṛṣarathaḥ suśipra vṛṣakrato vṛṣā vajrin bhare dhāḥ ||
Translation: So, fair of cheek, with mighty chariot, mighty, uphold us, strong-willed, thunderarmed, in battle.

Sanskit Text: यो रोहितौ वाजिनौ वाजिनीवान तरिभिः शतैः सचमानाव अदिष्ट |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo rohitau vājinau vājinīvān tribhiḥ śataiḥ sacamānāv adiṣṭa |
Translation: 6 Maruts, let all the people in obeisance bow down before this youthful Srutaratha,

Sanskit Text: यूने सम अस्मै कषितयो नमन्तां शरुतरथाय मरुतो दुवोया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūne sam asmai kṣitayo namantāṃ śrutarathāya maruto duvoyā ||
Translation: Who, rich in steeds, gave me two dark red horses together with three hundred head of cattle.

Sanskit Text: सम भानुना यतते सूर्यस्याजुह्वानो घर्तप्र्ष्ठः सवञ्चाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sam bhānunā yatate sūryasyājuhvāno ghṛtapṛṣṭhaḥ svañcāḥ |
Translation: 1. BEDEWED with holy oil and meetly worshipped, the Swift One vies with Sūrya's beam in splendour.

Sanskit Text: तस्मा अम्र्ध्रा उषसो वय उछान य इन्द्राय सुनवामेत्य आह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmā amṛdhrā uṣaso vy uchān ya indrāya sunavāmety āha ||
Translation: For him may mornings dawn without cessation who saith, Let us press Soma out for Indra.

Sanskit Text: समिद्धाग्निर वनवत सतीर्णबर्हिर युक्तग्रावा सुतसोमो जराते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samiddhāghnir vanavat stīrṇabarhir yuktaghrāvā sutasomo jarāte |
Translation: 2 With kindled fire and strewn grass let him worship, and, Soma-presser, sing with stones adjusted:

Sanskit Text: गरावाणो यस्येषिरं वदन्त्य अयद अध्वर्युर हविषाव सिन्धुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghrāvāṇo yasyeṣiraṃ vadanty ayad adhvaryur haviṣāva sindhum ||
Translation: And let the priest whose press-stones ring forth loudly, go down with his oblation to the river.

Sanskit Text: वधूर इयम पतिम इछन्त्य एति य ईं वहाते महिषीम इषिराम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vadhūr iyam patim ichanty eti ya īṃ vahāte mahiṣīm iṣirām |
Translation: 3 This wife is coming near who loves her husband who carries to his home a vigorous consort.

Sanskit Text: आस्य शरवस्याद रथ आ च घोषात पुरू सहस्रा परि वर्तयाते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsya śravasyād ratha ā ca ghoṣāt purū sahasrā pari vartayāte ||
Translation: Here may his car seek fame, here loudly thunder, and his wheel make a thousand revolutions.

Sanskit Text: न स राजा वयथते यस्मिन्न इन्द्रस तीव्रं सोमम पिबति गोसखायम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na sa rājā vyathate yasminn indras tīvraṃ somam pibati ghosakhāyam |
Translation: 4 No troubles vex that King in whose home Indra drinks the sharp Soma juice with milk commingled.

Sanskit Text: आ सत्वनैर अजति हन्ति वर्त्रं कषेति कषितीः सुभगो नाम पुष्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā satvanair ajati hanti vṛtraṃ kṣeti kṣitīḥ subhagho nāma puṣyan ||
Translation: With heroes he drives near, he slays the foeman: Blest, cherishing that name, he guards his people.

Sanskit Text: पुष्यात कषेमे अभि योगे भवात्य उभे वर्तौ संयती सं जयाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: puṣyāt kṣeme abhi yoghe bhavāty ubhe vṛtau saṃyatī saṃ jayāti |
Translation: 5 May he support in peace and win in battle: he masters both the hosts that meet together.

Sanskit Text: परियः सूर्ये परियो अग्ना भवाति य इन्द्राय सुतसोमो ददाशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyaḥ sūrye priyo aghnā bhavāti ya indrāya sutasomo dadāśat ||
Translation: Dear shall he be to Sūrya, dear to Agni, who with pressed Soma offers gifts to India.

Sanskit Text: उरोष ट इन्द्र राधसो विभ्वी रातिः शतक्रतो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uroṣ ṭa indra rādhaso vibhvī rātiḥ śatakrato |
Translation: 1. WIDE, Indra Śatakratu, spreads the bounty of thine ample grace:

Sanskit Text: अधा नो विश्वचर्षणे दयुम्ना सुक्षत्र मंहय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā no viśvacarṣaṇe dyumnā sukṣatra maṃhaya ||
Translation: So, Lord of fair dominion, Friend of all men, give us splendid wealth.

Sanskit Text: यद ईम इन्द्र शरवाय्यम इषं शविष्ठ दधिषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad īm indra śravāyyam iṣaṃ śaviṣṭha dadhiṣe |
Translation: 2 The food which, Mightiest Indra, thou possessest worthy of renown

Sanskit Text: पप्रथे दीर्घश्रुत्तमं हिरण्यवर्ण दुष्टरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: paprathe dīrghaśruttamaṃ hiraṇyavarṇa duṣṭaram ||
Translation: Is bruited as most widely famed, invincible, O Golden-hued!

Sanskit Text: शुष्मासो ये ते अद्रिवो मेहना केतसापः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuṣmāso ye te adrivo mehanā ketasāpaḥ |
Translation: 3 O Darter of the Stone, the powers which readily obey thy will,—

Sanskit Text: उभा देवाव अभिष्टये दिवश च गमश च राजथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhā devāv abhiṣṭaye divaś ca ghmaś ca rājathaḥ ||
Translation: Divinities, both thou and they, ye rule, to guard them, earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: उतो नो अस्य कस्य चिद दक्षस्य तव वर्त्रहन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto no asya kasya cid dakṣasya tava vṛtrahan |
Translation: 4 And from whatever power of thine, O Vṛtra-slayer, it may be,

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं नर्म्णम आ भरास्मभ्यं नर्मणस्यसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ nṛmṇam ā bharāsmabhyaṃ nṛmaṇasyase ||
Translation: Bring thou to us heroic strength: thou hast a man's regard for us.

Sanskit Text: नू त आभिर अभिष्टिभिस तव शर्मञ छतक्रतो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū ta ābhir abhiṣṭibhis tava śarmañ chatakrato |
Translation: 5 In thy protection, with these aids of thine, O Lord of Hundred Powers,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र सयाम सुगोपाः शूर सयाम सुगोपाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra syāma sughopāḥ śūra syāma sughopāḥ ||
Translation: Indra, may we be guarded well, Hero, may we be guarded well.

Sanskit Text: यद इन्द्र चित्र मेहनास्ति तवादातम अद्रिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad indra citra mehanāsti tvādātam adrivaḥ |
Translation: 1. STONE-DARTING Indra. Wondrous One, what wealth is richly given from thee,

Sanskit Text: राधस तन नो विदद्वस उभयाहस्त्य आ भर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rādhas tan no vidadvasa ubhayāhasty ā bhara ||
Translation: That bounty, Treasure-Finder! bring filling both thy hands, to us.

Sanskit Text: यन मन्यसे वरेण्यम इन्द्र दयुक्षं तद आ भर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yan manyase vareṇyam indra dyukṣaṃ tad ā bhara |
Translation: 2 Bring what thou deemest worth the wish, O Indra, that which is in heaven.

Sanskit Text: विद्याम तस्य ते वयम अकूपारस्य दावने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidyāma tasya te vayam akūpārasya dāvane ||
Translation: So may we know thee as thou art, boundless in thy munificence.

Sanskit Text: यत ते दित्सु परराध्यम मनो अस्ति शरुतम बर्हत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te ditsu prarādhyam mano asti śrutam bṛhat |
Translation: 3 Thy lofty spirit, far-renowned as fain to give and prompt to win,—

Sanskit Text: तेन दर्ळ्हा चिद अद्रिव आ वाजं दर्षि सातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tena dṛḷhā cid adriva ā vājaṃ darṣi sātaye ||
Translation: With this thou rendest e’en the firm, Stone-Darter! so to gain thee strength.

Sanskit Text: मंहिष्ठं वो मघोनां राजानं चर्षणीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: maṃhiṣṭhaṃ vo maghonāṃ rājānaṃ carṣaṇīnām |
Translation: 4 Singers with many songs have made Indra propitious to their fame,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रम उप परशस्तये पूर्वीभिर जुजुषे गिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indram upa praśastaye pūrvībhir jujuṣe ghiraḥ ||
Translation: Him who is King of human kind, most liberal of your wealthy ones.

Sanskit Text: अस्मा इत काव्यं वच उक्थम इन्द्राय शंस्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmā it kāvyaṃ vaca uktham indrāya śaṃsyam |
Translation: 5 To him, to Indra must be sung the poet's word, the hymn of praise.

Sanskit Text: तस्मा उ बरह्मवाहसे गिरो वर्धन्त्य अत्रयो गिरः शुम्भन्त्य अत्रयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmā u brahmavāhase ghiro vardhanty atrayo ghiraḥ śumbhanty atrayaḥ ||
Translation: To him, accepter of the prayer, the Atris raise their songs on high, the Atris beautify their songs.

Sanskit Text: आ याह्य अद्रिभिः सुतं सोमं सोमपते पिब |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yāhy adribhiḥ sutaṃ somaṃ somapate piba |
Translation: 1. COME thou to what the stones have pressed, drink Soma, O thou Soma's Lord,

Sanskit Text: वर्षन्न इन्द्र वर्षभिर वर्त्रहन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama ||
Translation: Indra best Vṛtra-slayer Strong One, with the Strong.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा गरावा वर्षा मदो वर्षा सोमो अयं सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā ghrāvā vṛṣā mado vṛṣā somo ayaṃ sutaḥ |
Translation: 2 Strong is the stone, the draught is strong, strong is this Soma that is pressed,

Sanskit Text: वर्षन्न इन्द्र वर्षभिर वर्त्रहन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama ||
Translation: Indra, best Vṛtra-slayer, Strong One with the Strong.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा तवा वर्षणं हुवे वज्रिञ चित्राभिर ऊतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇaṃ huve vajriñ citrābhir ūtibhiḥ |
Translation: 3 As strong I call on thee the Strong, O Thunder-armed, with various aids,

Sanskit Text: वर्षन्न इन्द्र वर्षभिर वर्त्रहन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama ||
Translation: Indra, best Vṛtra-slayer, Strong One with the Strong.

Sanskit Text: रजीषी वज्री वर्षभस तुराषाट छुष्मी राजा वर्त्रहा सोमपावा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛjīṣī vajrī vṛṣabhas turāṣāṭ chuṣmī rājā vṛtrahā somapāvā |
Translation: 4 Impetuous, Thunderer, Strong, quelling the mighty, King, potent, Vṛtra-slayer, Soma-drinker,

Sanskit Text: युक्त्वा हरिभ्याम उप यासद अर्वाङ माध्यंदिने सवने मत्सद इन्द्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuktvā haribhyām upa yāsad arvāṅ mādhyaṃdine savane matsad indraḥ ||
Translation: May he come hither with his yoked Bay Horses; may Indra gladden him at the noon libation.

Sanskit Text: यत तवा सूर्य सवर्भानुस तमसाविध्यद आसुरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat tvā sūrya svarbhānus tamasāvidhyad āsuraḥ |
Translation: 5 O Sūrya, when the Asura's descendant Svarbhanu, pierced thee through and through with darkness,
