Sanskit Text: अक्षेत्रविद यथा मुग्धो भुवनान्य अदीधयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: akṣetravid yathā mughdho bhuvanāny adīdhayuḥ ||
Translation: All creatures looked like one who is bewildered, who knoweth not the place where he is standing.

Sanskit Text: सवर्भानोर अध यद इन्द्र माया अवो दिवो वर्तमाना अवाहन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svarbhānor adha yad indra māyā avo divo vartamānā avāhan |
Translation: 6 What time thou smotest down Svarbhanu's magic that spread itself beneath the sky, O Indra,

Sanskit Text: गूळ्हं सूर्यं तमसापव्रतेन तुरीयेण बरह्मणाविन्दद अत्रिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghūḷhaṃ sūryaṃ tamasāpavratena turīyeṇa brahmaṇāvindad atriḥ ||
Translation: By his fourth sacred prayer Atri disoovered Sūrya concealed in gloom that stayed his function.

Sanskit Text: मा माम इमं तव सन्तम अत्र इरस्या दरुग्धो भियसा नि गारीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā mām imaṃ tava santam atra irasyā drughdho bhiyasā ni ghārīt |
Translation: 7 Let not the oppressor with this dread, through anger swallow me up, for I am thine, O Atri.

Sanskit Text: तवम मित्रो असि सत्यराधास तौ मेहावतं वरुणश च राजा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvam mitro asi satyarādhās tau mehāvataṃ varuṇaś ca rājā ||
Translation: Mitra art thou, the sender of true blessings: thou and King Varuṇa be both my helpers.

Sanskit Text: गराव्णो बरह्मा युयुजानः सपर्यन कीरिणा देवान नमसोपशिक्षन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghrāvṇo brahmā yuyujānaḥ saparyan kīriṇā devān namasopaśikṣan |
Translation: 8 The Brahman Atri, as he set the press-stones, serving the Gods with praise and adoration,

Sanskit Text: अत्रिः सूर्यस्य दिवि चक्षुर आधात सवर्भानोर अप माया अघुक्षत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atriḥ sūryasya divi cakṣur ādhāt svarbhānor apa māyā aghukṣat ||
Translation: Established in the heaven the eye of Sūrya, and caused Svarbhanu's magic arts to vanish.

Sanskit Text: यं वै सूर्यं सवर्भानुस तमसाविध्यद आसुरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ vai sūryaṃ svarbhānus tamasāvidhyad āsuraḥ |
Translation: 9 The Atris found the Sun again, him whom Svarbhanu of the brood

Sanskit Text: अत्रयस तम अन्व अविन्दन नह्य अन्ये अशक्नुवन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrayas tam anv avindan nahy anye aśaknuvan ||
Translation: Of Asuras had pierced with gloom. This none besides had power to do.

Sanskit Text: को नु वाम मित्रावरुणाव रतायन दिवो वा महः पार्थिवस्य वा दे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko nu vām mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtāyan divo vā mahaḥ pārthivasya vā de |
Translation: 1. WHO, Mitra-Varuṇa, is your pious servant to give you gifts from earth or mighty heaven?

Sanskit Text: रतस्य वा सदसि तरासीथां नो यज्ञायते वा पशुषो न वाजान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya vā sadasi trāsīthāṃ no yajñāyate vā paśuṣo na vājān ||
Translation: Preserve us in the seat of holy Order, and give the offerer power that winneth cattle.

Sanskit Text: ते नो मित्रो वरुणो अर्यमायुर इन्द्र रभुक्षा मरुतो जुषन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te no mitro varuṇo aryamāyur indra ṛbhukṣā maruto juṣanta |
Translation: 2 May Mitra, Varuṇa, Aryaman, and Āyu, Indra Ṛbhukṣan, and the Maruts, love us,

Sanskit Text: नमोभिर वा ये दधते सुव्र्क्तिं सतोमं रुद्राय मीळ्हुषे सजोषाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: namobhir vā ye dadhate suvṛktiṃ stomaṃ rudrāya mīḷhuṣe sajoṣāḥ ||
Translation: And they who of one mind with bounteous Rudra accept the hymn and laud with adorations.

Sanskit Text: आ वां येष्ठाश्विना हुवध्यै वातस्य पत्मन रथ्यस्य पुष्टौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ yeṣṭhāśvinā huvadhyai vātasya patman rathyasya puṣṭau |
Translation: 3 You will I call to feed the car-horse, Aśvins, with the wind's flight swiftest of those who travel:

Sanskit Text: उत वा दिवो असुराय मन्म परान्धांसीव यज्यवे भरध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta vā divo asurāya manma prāndhāṃsīva yajyave bharadhvam ||
Translation: Or also to the Asura of heaven, Worshipful, bring a hymn as ’twere libation.

Sanskit Text: पर सक्षणो दिव्यः कण्वहोता तरितो दिवः सजोषा वातो अग्निः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sakṣaṇo divyaḥ kaṇvahotā trito divaḥ sajoṣā vāto aghniḥ |
Translation: 4 The heavenly Victor, he whose priest is Kaṇva, Tṛta with Dyaus accordant, Vāta, Agni,

Sanskit Text: पूषा भगः परभ्र्थे विश्वभोजा आजिं न जग्मुर आश्वश्वतमाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūṣā bhaghaḥ prabhṛthe viśvabhojā ājiṃ na jaghmur āśvaśvatamāḥ ||
Translation: All-feeding Pūṣan, Bhaga sought the oblation, as they whose steeds are fleetest seek the contest.

Sanskit Text: पर वो रयिं युक्ताश्वम भरध्वं राय एषे ऽवसे दधीत धीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vo rayiṃ yuktāśvam bharadhvaṃ rāya eṣe 'vase dadhīta dhīḥ |
Translation: 5 Bring ye your riches forward borne on horses: let thought be framed for help and gain of treasure.

Sanskit Text: सुशेव एवैर औशिजस्य होता ये व एवा मरुतस तुराणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suśeva evair auśijasya hotā ye va evā marutas turāṇām ||
Translation: Blest he the priest of Auśija through courses, the courses which are yours the fleet, O Maruts.

Sanskit Text: पर वो वायुं रथयुजं कर्णुध्वम पर देवं विप्रम पनितारम अर्कैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vo vāyuṃ rathayujaṃ kṛṇudhvam pra devaṃ vipram panitāram arkaiḥ |
Translation: 6 Bring hither him who yokes the car, your Vāyu, who praises with his songs, the God and Singer;

Sanskit Text: इषुध्यव रतसापः पुरंधीर वस्वीर नो अत्र पत्नीर आ धिये धुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣudhyava ṛtasāpaḥ puraṃdhīr vasvīr no atra patnīr ā dhiye dhuḥ ||
Translation: And, praying and devout, noble and prudent, may the Gods’ Spouses in their thoughts retain us.

Sanskit Text: उप व एषे वन्द्येभिः शूषैः पर यह्वी दिवश चितयद्भिर अर्कैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa va eṣe vandyebhiḥ śūṣaiḥ pra yahvī divaś citayadbhir arkaiḥ |
Translation: 7 I speed to you with powers that should be honoured, with songs distinguishing Heaven's mighty Daughters,

Sanskit Text: उषासानक्ता विदुषीव विश्वम आ हा वहतो मर्त्याय यज्ञम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣāsānaktā viduṣīva viśvam ā hā vahato martyāya yajñam ||
Translation: Morning and Night, the Two, as ’twere all-knowing: these bring the sacrifice unto the mortal.

Sanskit Text: अभि वो अर्चे पोष्यावतो नॄन वास्तोष पतिं तवष्टारं रराणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi vo arce poṣyāvato nṝn vāstoṣ patiṃ tvaṣṭāraṃ rarāṇaḥ |
Translation: 8 You I extol, the nourishers of heroes bringing you gifts, Vastospati and Tvaṣṭar-

Sanskit Text: धन्या सजोषा धिषणा नमोभिर वनस्पतींर ओषधी राय एषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhanyā sajoṣā dhiṣaṇā namobhir vanaspatīṃr oṣadhī rāya eṣe ||
Translation: Rich Dhiṣaṇā accords through our obeisance - andTrees and Plants, for the swift gain of riches.

Sanskit Text: तुजे नस तने पर्वताः सन्तु सवैतवो ये वसवो न वीराः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tuje nas tane parvatāḥ santu svaitavo ye vasavo na vīrāḥ |
Translation: 9 Ours be the Parvatas, even they, for offspring, free-moving, who are Heroes like the Vasus.

Sanskit Text: पनित आप्त्यो यजतः सदा नो वर्धान नः शंसं नर्यो अभिष्टौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: panita āptyo yajataḥ sadā no vardhān naḥ śaṃsaṃ naryo abhiṣṭau ||
Translation: May holy Āptya, Friend of man, exalted, strengthen our word for ever and be near us.

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्णो अस्तोषि भूम्यस्य गर्भं तरितो नपातम अपां सुव्र्क्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṇo astoṣi bhūmyasya gharbhaṃ trito napātam apāṃ suvṛkti |
Translation: 10 Tṛta praised him, germ of the earthly hero, with pure songs him the Offspring of the Waters.

Sanskit Text: गर्णीते अग्निर एतरी न शूषैः शोचिष्केशो नि रिणाति वना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛṇīte aghnir etarī na śūṣaiḥ śociṣkeśo ni riṇāti vanā ||
Translation: Agn; with might neighs loudly like a charger: he of the flaming hair destroys the forests.

Sanskit Text: कथा महे रुद्रियाय बरवाम कद राये चिकितुषे भगाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kathā mahe rudriyāya bravāma kad rāye cikituṣe bhaghāya |
Translation: 11 How shall we speak to the great might of Rudra? How speak to Bhaga who takes thought for riches?

Sanskit Text: आप ओषधीर उत नो ऽवन्तु दयौर वना गिरयो वर्क्षकेशाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpa oṣadhīr uta no 'vantu dyaur vanā ghirayo vṛkṣakeśāḥ ||
Translation: May Plants, the Waters, and the Sky preserve us, and Woods and Mountains with their trees for tresses.

Sanskit Text: शर्णोतु न ऊर्जाम पतिर गिरः स नभस तरीयां इषिरः परिज्मा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇotu na ūrjām patir ghiraḥ sa nabhas tarīyāṃ iṣiraḥ parijmā |
Translation: 12 May the swift Wanderer, Lord of refreshments listen to our songs, who speeds throuih cloudy heaven:

Sanskit Text: शर्ण्वन्त्व आपः पुरो न शुभ्राः परि सरुचो बब्र्हाणस्याद्रेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇvantv āpaḥ puro na śubhrāḥ pari sruco babṛhāṇasyādreḥ ||
Translation: And may the Waters, bright like castles, hear us, as they flow onward from the cloven mountain.

Sanskit Text: विदा चिन नु महान्तो ये व एवा बरवाम दस्मा वार्यं दधानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidā cin nu mahānto ye va evā bravāma dasmā vāryaṃ dadhānāḥ |
Translation: 13 We know your ways, ye Mighty Ones receiving choice meed, ye Wonderful, we will proclaim it.

Sanskit Text: वयश चन सुभ्व आव यन्ति कषुभा मर्तम अनुयतं वधस्नैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaś cana subhva āva yanti kṣubhā martam anuyataṃ vadhasnaiḥ ||
Translation: Even strong birds descend not to the mortal who strives to reach them with swift blow and weapons.

Sanskit Text: आ दैव्यानि पार्थिवानि जन्मापश चाछा सुमखाय वोचम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā daivyāni pārthivāni janmāpaś cāchā sumakhāya vocam |
Translation: 14 Celestial and terrestrial generations, and Waters will I summon to the feasting.

Sanskit Text: वर्धन्तां दयावो गिरश चन्द्राग्रा उदा वर्धन्ताम अभिषाता अर्णाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vardhantāṃ dyāvo ghiraś candrāghrā udā vardhantām abhiṣātā arṇāḥ ||
Translation: May days with bright dawns cause my songs to prosper, and may the conquered streams increase their waters.

Sanskit Text: पदे-पदे मे जरिमा नि धायि वरूत्री वा शक्रा या पायुभिश च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pade-pade me jarimā ni dhāyi varūtrī vā śakrā yā pāyubhiś ca |
Translation: 15 Duly to each one hath my laud been offered. Strong be Varūtrī with her powers to succour.

Sanskit Text: सिषक्तु माता मही रसा नः समत सूरिभिर रजुहस्त रजुवनिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: siṣaktu mātā mahī rasā naḥ smat sūribhir ṛjuhasta ṛjuvaniḥ ||
Translation: May the great Mother Rasā here befriend us, straight-handed, with the princes, striving forward.

Sanskit Text: कथा दाशेम नमसा सुदानून एवया मरुतो अछोक्तौ परश्रवसो मरुतो अछोक्तौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kathā dāśema namasā sudānūn evayā maruto achoktau praśravaso maruto achoktau |
Translation: 16 How may we serve the Liberal Ones with worship, the Maruts swift of course in invocation, the Maruts far-renowned in invocation?

Sanskit Text: मा नो ऽहिर बुध्न्यो रिषे धाद अस्माकम भूद उपमातिवनिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no 'hir budhnyo riṣe dhād asmākam bhūd upamātivaniḥ ||
Translation: Let not the Dragon of the Deep annoy us, and gladly may he welcome our addresses.

Sanskit Text: इति चिन नु परजायै पशुमत्यै देवासो वनते मर्त्यो व आ देवासो वनते मर्त्यो वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iti cin nu prajāyai paśumatyai devāso vanate martyo va ā devāso vanate martyo vaḥ |
Translation: 17 Thus thinking, O ye Gods, the mortal wins you to give him increase of his herds of cattle: the mortal wins him, O ye Gods, your favour.

Sanskit Text: अत्रा शिवां तन्वो धासिम अस्या जरां चिन मे निर्र्तिर जग्रसीत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrā śivāṃ tanvo dhāsim asyā jarāṃ cin me nirṛtir jaghrasīta ||
Translation: Here he wins wholesome food to feed this body: as for mine old age, Nirrti consume it

Sanskit Text: तां वो देवाः सुमतिम ऊर्जयन्तीम इषम अश्याम वसवः शसा गोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāṃ vo devāḥ sumatim ūrjayantīm iṣam aśyāma vasavaḥ śasā ghoḥ |
Translation: 18 O Gods, may we obtain from you this favour, strengthening food through the Cow's praise, ye Vasus.

Sanskit Text: सा नः सुदानुर मर्ळयन्ती देवी परति दरवन्ती सुविताय गम्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā naḥ sudānur mṛḷayantī devī prati dravantī suvitāya ghamyāḥ ||
Translation: May she who gives good gifts, the gracious Goddes. s, come speeding nigh to us for our well-being.

Sanskit Text: अभि न इळा यूथस्य माता समन नदीभिर उर्वशी वा गर्णातु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi na iḷā yūthasya mātā sman nadībhir urvaśī vā ghṛṇātu |
Translation: 19 May Iḷā, Mother of the herds of cattle, and Urvasi with all the streams accept us;

Sanskit Text: उर्वशी वा बर्हद्दिवा गर्णानाभ्यूर्ण्वाना परभ्र्थस्यायोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: urvaśī vā bṛhaddivā ghṛṇānābhyūrṇvānā prabhṛthasyāyoḥ ||
Translation: May Urvasi in lofty heaven accepting, as she partakes the oblation of the living,

Sanskit Text: सिषक्तु न ऊर्जव्यस्य पुष्टेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: siṣaktu na ūrjavyasya puṣṭeḥ |
Translation: 20 Visit us while she shares Urjavya's food.

Sanskit Text: पर शंतमा वरुणं दीधिती गीर मित्रम भगम अदितिं नूनम अश्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra śaṃtamā varuṇaṃ dīdhitī ghīr mitram bhagham aditiṃ nūnam aśyāḥ |
Translation: 1. Now may our sweetest song with deep devotion reach Varuṇa, Mitra, Aditi, and Bhaga.

Sanskit Text: पर्षद्योनिः पञ्चहोता शर्णोत्व अतूर्तपन्था असुरो मयोभुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛṣadyoniḥ pañcahotā śṛṇotv atūrtapanthā asuro mayobhuḥ ||
Translation: May the Five Priests' Lord, dwelling in oblations, bliss-giving Asura, hear, whose paths are open.

Sanskit Text: परति मे सतोमम अदितिर जग्र्भ्यात सूनुं न माता हर्द्यं सुशेवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati me stomam aditir jaghṛbhyāt sūnuṃ na mātā hṛdyaṃ suśevam |
Translation: 2 May Aditi welcome, even as a mother her dear heart-gladdening son, my song that lauds her.

Sanskit Text: बरह्म परियं देवहितं यद अस्त्य अहम मित्रे वरुणे यन मयोभु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahma priyaṃ devahitaṃ yad asty aham mitre varuṇe yan mayobhu ||
Translation: The prayer they love, bliss-giving, God-appointed, I offer unto Varuṇa and Mitra.

Sanskit Text: उद ईरय कवितमं कवीनाम उनत्तैनम अभि मध्वा घर्तेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud īraya kavitamaṃ kavīnām unattainam abhi madhvā ghṛtena |
Translation: 3 In spirit him, the Sagest of the Sages; with sacrificial oil and meath bedew him

Sanskit Text: स नो वसूनि परयता हितानि चन्द्राणि देवः सविता सुवाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no vasūni prayatā hitāni candrāṇi devaḥ savitā suvāti ||
Translation: So then let him, God Savitar, provide us excellent, ready, and resplendent treasures.

Sanskit Text: सम इन्द्र णो मनसा नेषि गोभिः सं सूरिभिर हरिवः सं सवस्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sam indra ṇo manasā neṣi ghobhiḥ saṃ sūribhir harivaḥ saṃ svasti |
Translation: 4 With willing mind, Indra, vouchsafe us cattle, prosperity, Lord of Bays! and pious patrons;

Sanskit Text: सम बरह्मणा देवहितं यद अस्ति सं देवानां सुमत्या यज्ञियानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sam brahmaṇā devahitaṃ yad asti saṃ devānāṃ sumatyā yajñiyānām ||
Translation: And, with the sacred prayer by Gods appointed, give us the holy Deities' lovingkindness.

Sanskit Text: देवो भगः सविता रायो अंश इन्द्रो वर्त्रस्य संजितो धनानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devo bhaghaḥ savitā rāyo aṃśa indro vṛtrasya saṃjito dhanānām |
Translation: 5 God Bhaga, Savitar who deals forth riches, Indra, and they who conquer Vṛtra's treasures,

Sanskit Text: रभुक्षा वाज उत वा पुरंधिर अवन्तु नो अम्र्तासस तुरासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛbhukṣā vāja uta vā puraṃdhir avantu no amṛtāsas turāsaḥ ||
Translation: And Vāja and Ṛbhukṣan and Purandhi, the Mighty and Immortal Ones, protect us!

Sanskit Text: मरुत्वतो अप्रतीतस्य जिष्णोर अजूर्यतः पर बरवामा कर्तानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: marutvato apratītasya jiṣṇor ajūryataḥ pra bravāmā kṛtāni |
Translation: 6 Let us declare his deeds, the undecaying unrivalled Victor whom the Maruts follow.

Sanskit Text: न ते पूर्वे मघवन नापरासो न वीर्यं नूतनः कश चनाप ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na te pūrve maghavan nāparāso na vīryaṃ nūtanaḥ kaś canāpa ||
Translation: None of old times, O Maghavan, nor later, none of these days hath reached thy hero prowess.

Sanskit Text: उप सतुहि परथमं रत्नधेयम बर्हस्पतिं सनितारं धनानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa stuhi prathamaṃ ratnadheyam bṛhaspatiṃ sanitāraṃ dhanānām |
Translation: 7 Praise him the Chief who gives the boon of riches, Bṛhaspati distributor of treasures,

Sanskit Text: यः शंसते सतुवते शम्भविष्ठः पुरूवसुर आगमज जोहुवानम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ śaṃsate stuvate śambhaviṣṭhaḥ purūvasur āghamaj johuvānam ||
Translation: Who, blessing most the man who sings and praises, comes with abundant wealth to his invoker.

Sanskit Text: तवोतिभिः सचमाना अरिष्टा बर्हस्पते मघवानः सुवीराः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tavotibhiḥ sacamānā ariṣṭā bṛhaspate maghavānaḥ suvīrāḥ |
Translation: 8 Tended, Bṛhaspati, with thy protections, the princes are unharmed and girt by heroes.

Sanskit Text: ये अश्वदा उत वा सन्ति गोदा ये वस्त्रदाः सुभगास तेषु रायः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye aśvadā uta vā santi ghodā ye vastradāḥ subhaghās teṣu rāyaḥ ||
Translation: Wealth that brings bliss is found among the givers of horses and of cattle and of raiment.

Sanskit Text: विसर्माणं कर्णुहि वित्तम एषां ये भुञ्जते अप्र्णन्तो न उक्थैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: visarmāṇaṃ kṛṇuhi vittam eṣāṃ ye bhuñjate apṛṇanto na ukthaiḥ |
Translation: 9 Make their wealth flee who, through our hymns enjoying their riches, yield us not an ample guerdon.

Sanskit Text: अपव्रतान परसवे वाव्र्धानान बरह्मद्विषः सूर्याद यावयस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apavratān prasave vāvṛdhānān brahmadviṣaḥ sūryād yāvayasva ||
Translation: Far from the sun keep those who hate devotion, the godless, prospering in their vocation.

Sanskit Text: य ओहते रक्षसो देववीताव अचक्रेभिस तम मरुतो नि यात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya ohate rakṣaso devavītāv acakrebhis tam maruto ni yāta |
Translation: 10 With wheelless chariots drive down him, O Maruts, who at the feasts of Gods regards the demons.

Sanskit Text: यो वः शमीं शशमानस्य निन्दात तुछ्यान कामान करते सिष्विदानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vaḥ śamīṃ śaśamānasya nindāt tuchyān kāmān karate siṣvidānaḥ ||
Translation: May he, though bathed in sweat, form empty wishes, who blames his sacred rite who toils to serve you.

Sanskit Text: तम उ षटुहि यः सविषुः सुधन्वा यो विश्वस्य कषयति भेषजस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tam u ṣṭuhi yaḥ sviṣuḥ sudhanvā yo viśvasya kṣayati bheṣajasya |
Translation: 11 Praise him whose bow is strong and sure his arrow, him who is Lord of every balm that bealeth.

Sanskit Text: यक्ष्वा महे सौमनसाय रुद्रं नमोभिर देवम असुरं दुवस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yakṣvā mahe saumanasāya rudraṃ namobhir devam asuraṃ duvasya ||
Translation: Worship thou Rudra for his great good favour: adore the Asura, God, with salutations.

Sanskit Text: दमूनसो अपसो ये सुहस्ता वर्ष्णः पत्नीर नद्यो विभ्वतष्टाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: damūnaso apaso ye suhastā vṛṣṇaḥ patnīr nadyo vibhvataṣṭāḥ |
Translation: 12 May the House-friends, the cunning-handed Artists, may the Steer's Wives, the streams carved out by Vibhvan,

Sanskit Text: सरस्वती बर्हद्दिवोत राका दशस्यन्तीर वरिवस्यन्तु शुभ्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarasvatī bṛhaddivota rākā daśasyantīr varivasyantu śubhrāḥ ||
Translation: And may the fair Ones honour and befriend us, Sarasvatī, Brhaddiva, and Rākā.

Sanskit Text: पर सू महे सुशरणाय मेधां गिरम भरे नव्यसीं जायमानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sū mahe suśaraṇāya medhāṃ ghiram bhare navyasīṃ jāyamānām |
Translation: 13 My newest song, thought that now springs within me, I offer to the Great, the Sure Protector,

Sanskit Text: य आहना दुहितुर वक्षणासु रूपा मिनानो अक्र्णोद इदं नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya āhanā duhitur vakṣaṇāsu rūpā mināno akṛṇod idaṃ naḥ ||
Translation: Who made for us this All, in fond love laying each varied form within his Daughter's bosom.

Sanskit Text: पर सुष्टुति सतनयन्तं रुवन्तम इळस पतिं जरितर नूनम अश्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra suṣṭuti stanayantaṃ ruvantam iḷas patiṃ jaritar nūnam aśyāḥ |
Translation: 14 Now, even now, may thy fair praise, O Singer, attain Idaspati who roars and thunders,

Sanskit Text: यो अब्दिमां उदनिमां इयर्ति पर विद्युता रोदसी उक्षमाणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo abdimāṃ udanimāṃ iyarti pra vidyutā rodasī ukṣamāṇaḥ ||
Translation: Who, rich in clouds and waters with his lightning speeds forth bedewing both the earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: एष सतोमो मारुतं शर्धो अछा रुद्रस्य सूनूंर युवन्यूंर उद अश्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa stomo mārutaṃ śardho achā rudrasya sūnūṃr yuvanyūṃr ud aśyāḥ |
Translation: 15 May this my laud attain the troop of Maruts, those who are youths in act, the Sons of Rudra.

Sanskit Text: कामो राये हवते मा सवस्त्य उप सतुहि पर्षदश्वां अयासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kāmo rāye havate mā svasty upa stuhi pṛṣadaśvāṃ ayāsaḥ ||
Translation: The wish calls me to riches and well-being: praise the unwearied Ones whose steeds are dappled.

Sanskit Text: परैष सतोमः पर्थिवीम अन्तरिक्षं वनस्पतींर ओषधी राये अश्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: praiṣa stomaḥ pṛthivīm antarikṣaṃ vanaspatīṃr oṣadhī rāye aśyāḥ |
Translation: 16 May this my laud reach earth and air's mid-region, and forest trees and plants to win me riches.

Sanskit Text: देवो-देवः सुहवो भूतु मह्यम मा नो माता पर्थिवी दुर्मतौ धात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devo-devaḥ suhavo bhūtu mahyam mā no mātā pṛthivī durmatau dhāt ||
Translation: May every Deity be swift to listen, and Mother Earth with no ill thought regard me.

Sanskit Text: उरौ देवा अनिबाधे सयाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: urau devā anibādhe syāma |
Translation: 17 Gods, may we dwell in free untroubled bliss.

Sanskit Text: सम अश्विनोर अवसा नूतनेन मयोभुवा सुप्रणीती गमेम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī ghamema |
Translation: 18 May we obtain the Aśvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy guidance.

Sanskit Text: आ नो रयिं वहतम ओत वीरान आ विश्वान्य अम्र्ता सौभगानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no rayiṃ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhaghāni ||
Translation: Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!

Sanskit Text: आ धेनवः पयसा तूर्ण्यर्था अमर्धन्तीर उप नो यन्तु मध्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā dhenavaḥ payasā tūrṇyarthā amardhantīr upa no yantu madhvā |
Translation: 1. MAY the Milch-cows who hasten to their object come harmless unto us with liquid sweetness.

Sanskit Text: महो राये बर्हतीः सप्त विप्रो मयोभुवो जरिता जोहवीति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maho rāye bṛhatīḥ sapta vipro mayobhuvo jaritā johavīti ||
Translation: The Singer, lauding, calls, for ample riches, the Seven Mighty Ones who bring enjoyment.

Sanskit Text: आ सुष्टुती नमसा वर्तयध्यै दयावा वाजाय पर्थिवी अम्र्ध्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā suṣṭutī namasā vartayadhyai dyāvā vājāya pṛthivī amṛdhre |
Translation: 2 With reverence and fair praise will I bring hither, for sake of strength, exhaustless Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: पिता माता मधुवचाः सुहस्ता भरे-भरे नो यशसाव अविष्टाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pitā mātā madhuvacāḥ suhastā bhare-bhare no yaśasāv aviṣṭām ||
Translation: Father and Mother, sweetof speech, fairhanded, may they, far-famed, in every fight protect us.

Sanskit Text: अध्वर्यवश चक्र्वांसो मधूनि पर वायवे भरत चारु शुक्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhvaryavaś cakṛvāṃso madhūni pra vāyave bharata cāru śukram |
Translation: 3 Adhvaryus, make the sweet libations ready, and bring the beautiful bright juice to Vāyu.

Sanskit Text: होतेव नः परथमः पाह्य अस्य देव मध्वो ररिमा ते मदाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hoteva naḥ prathamaḥ pāhy asya deva madhvo rarimā te madāya ||
Translation: God, as our Priest, be thou the first to drink it: we give thee of the mead to make thee joyful.

Sanskit Text: दश कषिपो युञ्जते बाहू अद्रिं सोमस्य या शमितारा सुहस्ता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśa kṣipo yuñjate bāhū adriṃ somasya yā śamitārā suhastā |
Translation: 4 Two arms-the Soma's dexterous immo. lators-and the ten fingers set and fix the press-stone.

Sanskit Text: मध्वो रसं सुगभस्तिर गिरिष्ठां चनिश्चदद दुदुहे शुक्रम अंशुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhvo rasaṃ sughabhastir ghiriṣṭhāṃ caniścadad duduhe śukram aṃśuḥ ||
Translation: The stalk hath poured, fair with its spreading branches, the mead's bright glittering juice that dwells on mountains.

Sanskit Text: असावि ते जुजुषाणाय सोमः करत्वे दक्षाय बर्हते मदाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asāvi te jujuṣāṇāya somaḥ kratve dakṣāya bṛhate madāya |
Translation: 5 The Soma hath been pressed for thee, its lover, to give thee power and might and high enjoyment.

Sanskit Text: हरी रथे सुधुरा योगे अर्वाग इन्द्र परिया कर्णुहि हूयमानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: harī rathe sudhurā yoghe arvāgh indra priyā kṛṇuhi hūyamānaḥ ||
Translation: Invoked, turn hither in thy car, O Indra, at need, thy two well-trained and dear Bay Horses.

Sanskit Text: आ नो महीम अरमतिं सजोषा गनां देवीं नमसा रातहव्याम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no mahīm aramatiṃ sajoṣā ghnāṃ devīṃ namasā rātahavyām |
Translation: 6 Bring by God-traversed paths, accordant, Agni, the great Aramati, Celestial Lady,

Sanskit Text: मधोर मदाय बर्हतीम रतज्ञाम आग्ने वह पथिभिर देवयानैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhor madāya bṛhatīm ṛtajñām āghne vaha pathibhir devayānaiḥ ||
Translation: Exalted, worshipped with our gifts and homage, who knoweth holy Law, to drink sweet Soma.

Sanskit Text: अञ्जन्ति यम परथयन्तो न विप्रा वपावन्तं नाग्निना तपन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: añjanti yam prathayanto na viprā vapāvantaṃ nāghninā tapantaḥ |
Translation: 7 As on his father's lap the son, the darling, so on the fire is set the sacred caldron,

Sanskit Text: पितुर न पुत्र उपसि परेष्ठ आ घर्मो अग्निम रतयन्न असादि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pitur na putra upasi preṣṭha ā gharmo aghnim ṛtayann asādi ||
Translation: Which holy singers deck, as if extending and heating that which holds the fatty membrane.

Sanskit Text: अछा मही बर्हती शंतमा गीर दूतो न गन्त्व अश्विना हुवध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā mahī bṛhatī śaṃtamā ghīr dūto na ghantv aśvinā huvadhyai |
Translation: 8 Hither, as herald to invite the Aśvins, come the great lofty song, most sweet and pleasant!

Sanskit Text: मयोभुवा सरथा यातम अर्वाग गन्तं निधिं धुरम आणिर न नाभिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mayobhuvā sarathā yātam arvāgh ghantaṃ nidhiṃ dhuram āṇir na nābhim ||
Translation: Come in one car, joy-givers! to the banquet, like the bolt binding pole and nave, come hither.

Sanskit Text: पर तव्यसो नमक्तिं तुरस्याहम पूष्ण उत वायोर अदिक्षि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra tavyaso namaktiṃ turasyāham pūṣṇa uta vāyor adikṣi |
Translation: 9 I have declared this speech of adoration to mightiest Pūṣan and victorious Vāyu,

Sanskit Text: या राधसा चोदितारा मतीनां या वाजस्य दरविणोदा उत तमन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā rādhasā coditārā matīnāṃ yā vājasya draviṇodā uta tman ||
Translation: Who by their bounty are the hymns' inspirers, and of themselves give power as a possession.

Sanskit Text: आ नामभिर मरुतो वक्षि विश्वान आ रूपेभिर जातवेदो हुवानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā nāmabhir maruto vakṣi viśvān ā rūpebhir jātavedo huvānaḥ |
Translation: 10 Invoked by us bring hither, jatavedas the Maruts all under their names and figures.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञं गिरो जरितुः सुष्टुतिं च विश्वे गन्त मरुतो विश्व ऊती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñaṃ ghiro jarituḥ suṣṭutiṃ ca viśve ghanta maruto viśva ūtī ||
Translation: Come to the sacrifice with aid all Maruts, all to the songs and praises of the singer!

Sanskit Text: आ नो दिवो बर्हतः पर्वताद आ सरस्वती यजता गन्तु यज्ञम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no divo bṛhataḥ parvatād ā sarasvatī yajatā ghantu yajñam |
Translation: 11 From high heaven may Sarasvatī the Holy visit our sacrifice, and from the mountain.

Sanskit Text: हवं देवी जुजुषाणा घर्ताची शग्मां नो वाचम उशती शर्णोतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: havaṃ devī jujuṣāṇā ghṛtācī śaghmāṃ no vācam uśatī śṛṇotu ||
Translation: Eager, propitious, may the balmy Goddess hear our effectual speech, our invocation.

Sanskit Text: आ वेधसं नीलप्र्ष्ठम बर्हन्तम बर्हस्पतिं सदने सादयध्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vedhasaṃ nīlapṛṣṭham bṛhantam bṛhaspatiṃ sadane sādayadhvam |
Translation: 12 Set in his seat the God whose back is dusky, Bṛhaspati the lofty, the Disposer.

Sanskit Text: सादद्योनिं दम आ दीदिवांसं हिरण्यवर्णम अरुषं सपेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sādadyoniṃ dama ā dīdivāṃsaṃ hiraṇyavarṇam aruṣaṃ sapema ||
Translation: Him let us worship, set within the dwelling, the red, the golden-hued, the allresplendent.

Sanskit Text: आ धर्णसिर बर्हद्दिवो रराणो विश्वेभिर गन्त्व ओमभिर हुवानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā dharṇasir bṛhaddivo rarāṇo viśvebhir ghantv omabhir huvānaḥ |
Translation: 13 May the Sustainer, high in heaven, come hither, the Bounteous One, invoked, with all his favours,

Sanskit Text: गना वसान ओषधीर अम्र्ध्रस तरिधातुश्र्ङगो वर्षभो वयोधाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghnā vasāna oṣadhīr amṛdhras tridhātuśṛṅgho vṛṣabho vayodhāḥ ||
Translation: Dweller with Dames divine, with plants, unwearied, the Steer with triple horn, the life-bestower.

Sanskit Text: मातुष पदे परमे शुक्र आयोर विपन्यवो रास्पिरासो अग्मन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mātuṣ pade parame śukra āyor vipanyavo rāspirāso aghman |
Translation: 14 The tuneful eloquent priests of him who liveth have sought the Mother's bright and loftiest station.

Sanskit Text: सुशेव्यं नमसा रातहव्याः शिशुम मर्जन्त्य आयवो न वासे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suśevyaṃ namasā rātahavyāḥ śiśum mṛjanty āyavo na vāse ||
Translation: As living men, with offered gifts and homage they deck the most auspicious Child to clothe him.

Sanskit Text: बर्हद वयो बर्हते तुभ्यम अग्ने धियाजुरो मिथुनासः सचन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhad vayo bṛhate tubhyam aghne dhiyājuro mithunāsaḥ sacanta |
Translation: 15 Agni, great vital power is thine, the mighty: pairs waxing old in their devotion seek thee.

Sanskit Text: देवो-देवः सुहवो भूतु मह्यम मा नो माता पर्थिवी दुर्मतौ धात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devo-devaḥ suhavo bhūtu mahyam mā no mātā pṛthivī durmatau dhāt ||
Translation: May every Deity be swift to listen, and Mother Earth with no ill thought regard me.

Sanskit Text: उरौ देवा अनिबाधे सयाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: urau devā anibādhe syāma |
Translation: 16 Gods, may we dwell in free untroubled bliss.

Sanskit Text: सम अश्विनोर अवसा नूतनेन मयोभुवा सुप्रणीती गमेम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī ghamema |
Translation: 17 May we obtain the Aśvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy guidance.

Sanskit Text: आ नो रयिं वहतम ओत वीरान आ विश्वान्य अम्र्ता सौभगानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no rayiṃ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhaghāni ||
Translation: Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!

Sanskit Text: विदा दिवो विष्यन्न अद्रिम उक्थैर आयत्या उषसो अर्चिनो गुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidā divo viṣyann adrim ukthair āyatyā uṣaso arcino ghuḥ |
Translation: 1. BARDS of approaching Dawn who know the heavens are come with hymns to throw the mountain open.

Sanskit Text: अपाव्र्त वरजिनीर उत सवर गाद वि दुरो मानुषीर देव आवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāvṛta vrajinīr ut svar ghād vi duro mānuṣīr deva āvaḥ ||
Translation: The Sun hath risen and oped the stable portals: the doors of men, too, hath the God thrown open.

Sanskit Text: वि सूर्यो अमतिं न शरियं साद ओर्वाद गवाम माता जानती गात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi sūryo amatiṃ na śriyaṃ sād orvād ghavām mātā jānatī ghāt |
Translation: 2 Sūrya hath spread his light as splendour: hither came the Cows' Mother, conscious, from the stable,

Sanskit Text: धन्वर्णसो नद्यः खादोर्णा सथूणेव सुमिता दरंहत दयौः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhanvarṇaso nadyaḥ khādoarṇā sthūṇeva sumitā dṛṃhata dyauḥ ||
Translation: To streams that flow with biting waves to deserts; and heaven is stablished like a firm-set pillar.

Sanskit Text: अस्मा उक्थाय पर्वतस्य गर्भो महीनां जनुषे पूर्व्याय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmā ukthāya parvatasya gharbho mahīnāṃ januṣe pūrvyāya |
Translation: 3 This laud hath won the burden of the mountain. To aid the ancient birth of mighty waters

Sanskit Text: वि पर्वतो जिहीत साधत दयौर आविवासन्तो दसयन्त भूम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi parvato jihīta sādhata dyaur āvivāsanto dasayanta bhūma ||
Translation: The mountain parted, Heaven performed his office. The worshippers were worn with constant serving.

Sanskit Text: सूक्तेभिर वो वचोभिर देवजुष्टैर इन्द्रा नव अग्नी अवसे हुवध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūktebhir vo vacobhir devajuṣṭair indrā nv aghnī avase huvadhyai |
Translation: 4 With hymns and God-loved words will I invoke you, Indra and Agni, to obtain your favour,

Sanskit Text: उक्थेभिर हि षमा कवयः सुयज्ञा आविवासन्तो मरुतो यजन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukthebhir hi ṣmā kavayaḥ suyajñā āvivāsanto maruto yajanti ||
Translation: For verily sages, skilled in sacrificing, worship the Maruts and with lauds invite them.

Sanskit Text: एतो नव अद्य सुध्यो भवाम पर दुछुना मिनवामा वरीयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eto nv adya sudhyo bhavāma pra duchunā minavāmā varīyaḥ |
Translation: 5 This day approach us: may our thoughts be holy, far from us let us cast away misfortune.

Sanskit Text: आरे दवेषांसि सनुतर दधामायाम पराञ्चो यजमानम अछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āre dveṣāṃsi sanutar dadhāmāyāma prāñco yajamānam acha ||
Translation: Let us keep those who hate us at a distance, and haste to meet the man who sacrifices.

Sanskit Text: एता धियं कर्णवामा सखायो ऽप या मातां रणुत वरजं गोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etā dhiyaṃ kṛṇavāmā sakhāyo 'pa yā mātāṃ ṛṇuta vrajaṃ ghoḥ |
Translation: 6 Come, let us carry out, O friends, the purpose wherewith the Mother threw the Cow's stall open,

Sanskit Text: यया मनुर विशिशिप्रं जिगाय यया वणिग वङकुर आपा पुरीषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayā manur viśiśipraṃ jighāya yayā vaṇigh vaṅkur āpā purīṣam ||
Translation: That wherewith Manu conquered Visisipra, wherewith the wandering merchant gained heaven's water.

Sanskit Text: अनूनोद अत्र हस्तयतो अद्रिर आर्चन येन दश मासो नवग्वाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anūnod atra hastayato adrir ārcan yena daśa māso navaghvāḥ |
Translation: 7 Here, urged by hands, loudly hath rung the press-stone wherewith Navagvas through ten months sang praises.

Sanskit Text: रतं यती सरमा गा अविन्दद विश्वानि सत्याङगिराश चकार ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtaṃ yatī saramā ghā avindad viśvāni satyāṅghirāś cakāra ||
Translation: Saramā went aright and found the cattle. Aṅgiras gave effect to all their labours.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे अस्या वयुषि माहिनायाः सं यद गोभिर अङगिरसो नवन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve asyā vyuṣi māhināyāḥ saṃ yad ghobhir aṅghiraso navanta |
Translation: 8 When at the dawning of this mighty Goddess, Aṅgirases all sang forth with the cattle,—

Sanskit Text: उत्स आसाम परमे सधस्थ रतस्य पथा सरमा विदद गाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utsa āsām parame sadhastha ṛtasya pathā saramā vidad ghāḥ ||
Translation: Their spring is in the loftiest place of meeting,—Saramā found the kine by Order's pathway.

Sanskit Text: आ सूर्यो यातु सप्ताश्वः कषेत्रं यद अस्योर्विया दीर्घयाथे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā sūryo yātu saptāśvaḥ kṣetraṃ yad asyorviyā dīrghayāthe |
Translation: 9 Borne by his Coursers Seven may Sūrya visit the field that spreadeth wide for his long journey.

Sanskit Text: रघुः शयेनः पतयद अन्धो अछा युवा कविर दीदयद गोषु गछन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: raghuḥ śyenaḥ patayad andho achā yuvā kavir dīdayad ghoṣu ghachan ||
Translation: Down on the Soma swooped the rapid Falcon. Bright was the young Sage moving mid his cattle.

Sanskit Text: आ सूर्यो अरुहच छुक्रम अर्णो ऽयुक्त यद धरितो वीतप्र्ष्ठाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā sūryo aruhac chukram arṇo 'yukta yad dharito vītapṛṣṭhāḥ |
Translation: 10 Sūrya hath mounted to the shining ocean when he hath yoked his fair-backed Tawny Horses.

Sanskit Text: उद्ना न नावम अनयन्त धीरा आश्र्ण्वतीर आपो अर्वाग अतिष्ठन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: udnā na nāvam anayanta dhīrā āśṛṇvatīr āpo arvāgh atiṣṭhan ||
Translation: The wise have drawn him like a ship through water: the floods obedient have descended hither.

Sanskit Text: धियं वो अप्सु दधिषे सवर्षां ययातरन दश मासो नवग्वाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiyaṃ vo apsu dadhiṣe svarṣāṃ yayātaran daśa māso navaghvāḥ |
Translation: 11 I lay upon the Floods your hymn, lightwinning, wherewith Navagvas their ten months completed.

Sanskit Text: अया धिया सयाम देवगोपा अया धिया तुतुर्यामात्य अंहः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayā dhiyā syāma devaghopā ayā dhiyā tuturyāmāty aṃhaḥ ||
Translation: Through this our hymn may we have Gods to guard us: through this our hymn pass safe beyond affliction.

Sanskit Text: हयो न विद्वां अयुजि सवयं धुरि तां वहामि परतरणीम अवस्युवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hayo na vidvāṃ ayuji svayaṃ dhuri tāṃ vahāmi prataraṇīm avasyuvam |
Translation: 1. WELL knowing I have bound me, horselike, to the pole: I carry that which bears as on and gives us help.

Sanskit Text: नास्या वश्मि विमुचं नाव्र्तम पुनर विद्वान पथः पुरेत रजु नेषति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāsyā vaśmi vimucaṃ nāvṛtam punar vidvān pathaḥ puraeta ṛju neṣati ||
Translation: I seek for no release, no turning back therefrom. May he who knows the way, the Leader, guide me straight.

Sanskit Text: अग्न इन्द्र वरुण मित्र देवाः शर्धः पर यन्त मारुतोत विष्णो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghna indra varuṇa mitra devāḥ śardhaḥ pra yanta mārutota viṣṇo |
Translation: 2 O Agni, Indra, Varuṇa, and Mitra, give, O ye Gods, and Marut host, and Viṣṇu.

Sanskit Text: उभा नासत्या रुद्रो अध गनाः पूषा भगः सरस्वती जुषन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhā nāsatyā rudro adha ghnāḥ pūṣā bhaghaḥ sarasvatī juṣanta ||
Translation: May both Nāsatyas, Rudra, heavenly Matrons, Pūṣan, Sarasvatī, Bhaga, accept us.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी मित्रावरुणादितिं सवः पर्थिवीं दयाम मरुतः पर्वतां अपः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī mitrāvaruṇāditiṃ svaḥ pṛthivīṃ dyām marutaḥ parvatāṃ apaḥ |
Translation: 3 Indra and Agni, Mitra, Varuṇa, Aditi, the Waters, Mountains, Maruts, Sky, and Earth and Heaven,

Sanskit Text: हुवे विष्णुम पूषणम बरह्मणस पतिम भगं नु शंसं सवितारम ऊतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: huve viṣṇum pūṣaṇam brahmaṇas patim bhaghaṃ nu śaṃsaṃ savitāram ūtaye ||
Translation: Viṣṇu I call, Pūṣan, and Brahmaṇaspati, and Bhaga, Samsa, Savitar that they may help.

Sanskit Text: उत नो विष्णुर उत वातो अस्रिधो दरविणोदा उत सोमो मयस करत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta no viṣṇur uta vāto asridho draviṇodā uta somo mayas karat |
Translation: 4 May Viṣṇu also and Vāta who injures none, and Soma granter of possessions give us joy;

Sanskit Text: उत रभव उत राये नो अश्विनोत तवष्टोत विभ्वानु मंसते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta ṛbhava uta rāye no aśvinota tvaṣṭota vibhvānu maṃsate ||
Translation: And may the Ṛbhus and the Aśvins, Tvaṣṭar and Vibhvan remember us so that we may have wealth.

Sanskit Text: उत तयन नो मारुतं शर्ध आ गमद दिविक्षयं यजतम बर्हिर आसदे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tyan no mārutaṃ śardha ā ghamad divikṣayaṃ yajatam barhir āsade |
Translation: 5 So may the band of Maruts dwelling in the sky, the holy, come to us to sit on sacred grass;

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिः शर्म पूषोत नो यमद वरूथ्यं वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiḥ śarma pūṣota no yamad varūthyaṃ varuṇo mitro aryamā ||
Translation: Bṛhaspati and Pūṣan grant us sure defence, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman guard and shelter us.

Sanskit Text: उत तये नः पर्वतासः सुशस्तयः सुदीतयो नद्यस तरामणे भुवन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tye naḥ parvatāsaḥ suśastayaḥ sudītayo nadyas trāmaṇe bhuvan |
Translation: 6 And may the Mountains famed in noble eulogies, and the fair-gleaming Rivers keep us safe from harm.

Sanskit Text: भगो विभक्ता शवसावसा गमद उरुव्यचा अदितिः शरोतु मे हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhagho vibhaktā śavasāvasā ghamad uruvyacā aditiḥ śrotu me havam ||
Translation: May Bhaga the Dispenser come with power and grace, and far-pervading Aditi listen to my call.

Sanskit Text: देवानाम पत्नीर उशतीर अवन्तु नः परावन्तु नस तुजये वाजसातये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānām patnīr uśatīr avantu naḥ prāvantu nas tujaye vājasātaye |
Translation: 7 May the Gods’ Spouses aid us of their own freewill, aid us to offspring and the winning of the spoil.

Sanskit Text: याः पार्थिवासो या अपाम अपि वरते ता नो देवीः सुहवाः शर्म यछत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāḥ pārthivāso yā apām api vrate tā no devīḥ suhavāḥ śarma yachata ||
Translation: Grant us protection, O ye gracious Goddesses, ye who are on the earth or in the waters' realm.

Sanskit Text: उत गना वयन्तु देवपत्नीर इन्द्राण्य अग्नाय्य अश्विनी राट |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta ghnā vyantu devapatnīr indrāṇy aghnāyy aśvinī rāṭ |
Translation: 8 May the Dames, wives of Gods, enjoy our presents, Rat, Aśvini, Agnāyī, and Indrāṇī.

Sanskit Text: आ रोदसी वरुणानी शर्णोतु वयन्तु देवीर य रतुर जनीनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā rodasī varuṇānī śṛṇotu vyantu devīr ya ṛtur janīnām ||
Translation: May Rodasī and Varuṇānī hear us, and Goddesses come at the Matrons' season.

Sanskit Text: परयुञ्जती दिव एति बरुवाणा मही माता दुहितुर बोधयन्ती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prayuñjatī diva eti bruvāṇā mahī mātā duhitur bodhayantī |
Translation: 1. URGING to toil and making proclamation, seeking Heaven's Daughter comes the Mighty Mother:

Sanskit Text: आविवासन्ती युवतिर मनीषा पित्र्भ्य आ सदने जोहुवाना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvivāsantī yuvatir manīṣā pitṛbhya ā sadane johuvānā ||
Translation: She comes, the youthful Hymn, unto the Fathers, inviting to her home and loudly calling.

Sanskit Text: अजिरासस तदप ईयमाना आतस्थिवांसो अम्र्तस्य नाभिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajirāsas tadapa īyamānā ātasthivāṃso amṛtasya nābhim |
Translation: 2 Swift in their motion, hasting to their duty, reaching the central point of life immortal,

Sanskit Text: अनन्तास उरवो विश्वतः सीम परि दयावाप्र्थिवी यन्ति पन्थाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anantāsa uravo viśvataḥ sīm pari dyāvāpṛthivī yanti panthāḥ ||
Translation: On every side about the earth and heaven go forth the spacious paths without a limit.

Sanskit Text: उक्षा समुद्रो अरुषः सुपर्णः पूर्वस्य योनिम पितुर आ विवेश |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukṣā samudro aruṣaḥ suparṇaḥ pūrvasya yonim pitur ā viveśa |
Translation: 3 Steer, Sea, Red Bird with strong wings, he hath entered the dwelling-place of the Primeval Father.

Sanskit Text: मध्ये दिवो निहितः पर्श्निर अश्मा वि चक्रमे रजसस पात्य अन्तौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhye divo nihitaḥ pṛśnir aśmā vi cakrame rajasas pāty antau ||
Translation: A gay-hued Stone set in the midst of heaven, he hath gone forth and guards mid-air's two limits.

Sanskit Text: चत्वार ईम बिभ्रति कषेमयन्तो दश गर्भं चरसे धापयन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: catvāra īm bibhrati kṣemayanto daśa gharbhaṃ carase dhāpayante |
Translation: 4 Four bear him up and give him rest and quiet, and ten invigorate the Babe for travel.

Sanskit Text: तरिधातवः परमा अस्य गावो दिवश चरन्ति परि सद्यो अन्तान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tridhātavaḥ paramā asya ghāvo divaś caranti pari sadyo antān ||
Translation: His kine most excellent, of threefold nature, pass swiftly round the boundaries of heaven.

Sanskit Text: इदं वपुर निवचनं जनासश चरन्ति यन नद्यस तस्थुर आपः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ vapur nivacanaṃ janāsaś caranti yan nadyas tasthur āpaḥ |
Translation: 5 Wondrous, O people, is the mystic knowledge that while the waters stand the streams are flowing:

Sanskit Text: दवे यद ईम बिभ्र्तो मातुर अन्ये इहेह जाते यम्य्र सबन्धू ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dve yad īm bibhṛto mātur anye iheha jāte yamyṛ sabandhū ||
Translation: That, separate from his Mother, Two support him, closely-united, twins, here made apparent.

Sanskit Text: वि तन्वते धियो अस्मा अपांसि वस्त्रा पुत्राय मातरो वयन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi tanvate dhiyo asmā apāṃsi vastrā putrāya mātaro vayanti |
Translation: 6 For him they lenghten prayers and acts of worship: the Mothers weave garments for him their offspring.

Sanskit Text: उपप्रक्षे वर्षणो मोदमाना दिवस पथा वध्वो यन्त्य अछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upaprakṣe vṛṣaṇo modamānā divas pathā vadhvo yanty acha ||
Translation: Rejoicing, for the Steer's impregning contact, his Spouses move on paths or heaven to meet him.

Sanskit Text: तद अस्तु मित्रावरुणा तद अग्ने शं योर अस्मभ्यम इदम अस्तु शस्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad astu mitrāvaruṇā tad aghne śaṃ yor asmabhyam idam astu śastam |
Translation: 7 Be this our praise, O Varuṇa and Mitra may this be health and force to us, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: अशीमहि गाधम उत परतिष्ठां नमो दिवे बर्हते सादनाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśīmahi ghādham uta pratiṣṭhāṃ namo dive bṛhate sādanāya ||
Translation: May we obtain firm ground and room for resting: Glory to Heaven, the lofty habitation!

Sanskit Text: कद उ परियाय धाम्ने मनामहे सवक्षत्राय सवयशसे महे वयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kad u priyāya dhāmne manāmahe svakṣatrāya svayaśase mahe vayam |
Translation: 1. WHAT may we meditate for the beloved Power, mighty in native strength and glorious in itself,

Sanskit Text: आमेन्यस्य रजसो यद अभ्र आं अपो वर्णाना वितनोति मायिनी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āmenyasya rajaso yad abhra āṃ apo vṛṇānā vitanoti māyinī ||
Translation: Which as a magic energy seeking waters spreads even to theimmeasurable middle region's cloud?

Sanskit Text: ता अत्नत वयुनं वीरवक्षणं समान्या वर्तया विश्वम आ रजः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā atnata vayunaṃ vīravakṣaṇaṃ samānyā vṛtayā viśvam ā rajaḥ |
Translation: 2 O'er all the region with their uniform advance these have spread out the lore that giveth heroes strength.

Sanskit Text: अपो अपाचीर अपरा अपेजते पर पूर्वाभिस तिरते देवयुर जनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apo apācīr aparā apejate pra pūrvābhis tirate devayur janaḥ ||
Translation: Back, with their course reversed, the others pass away: the pious lengthens life with those that are before.

Sanskit Text: आ गरावभिर अहन्येभिर अक्तुभिर वरिष्ठं वज्रम आ जिघर्ति मायिनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ghrāvabhir ahanyebhir aktubhir variṣṭhaṃ vajram ā jigharti māyini |
Translation: 3 With pressing-stones and with the bright beams of the day he hurls his broadest bolt against the Guileful One.

Sanskit Text: शतं वा यस्य परचरन सवे दमे संवर्तयन्तो वि च वर्तयन्न अहा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ vā yasya pracaran sve dame saṃvartayanto vi ca vartayann ahā ||
Translation: Even he whose hundred wander in his own abode, driving the days afar and bringing them again.

Sanskit Text: ताम अस्य रीतिम परशोर इव परत्य अनीकम अख्यम भुजे अस्य वर्पसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tām asya rītim paraśor iva praty anīkam akhyam bhuje asya varpasaḥ |
Translation: 4 I, to enjoy the beauty of his form, behold that rapid rush of his as ’twere an axe's edge,

Sanskit Text: सचा यदि पितुमन्तम इव कषयं रत्नं दधाति भरहूतये विशे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sacā yadi pitumantam iva kṣayaṃ ratnaṃ dadhāti bharahūtaye viśe ||
Translation: What time he gives the man who calls on him in fight wealth like a dwelling-house filled full with store of food.

Sanskit Text: स जिह्वया चतुरनीक रञ्जते चारु वसानो वरुणो यतन्न अरिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa jihvayā caturanīka ṛñjate cāru vasāno varuṇo yatann arim |
Translation: 5 Four-faced and nobly clad, Varuṇa, urging on the pious to his task, stirs himself with the tongue.

Sanskit Text: न तस्य विद्म पुरुषत्वता वयं यतो भगः सविता दाति वार्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na tasya vidma puruṣatvatā vayaṃ yato bhaghaḥ savitā dāti vāryam ||
Translation: Naught by our human nature do we know of him, him from whom Bhaga Savitar bestows the boon.

Sanskit Text: देवं वो अद्य सवितारम एषे भगं च रत्नं विभजन्तम आयोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devaṃ vo adya savitāram eṣe bhaghaṃ ca ratnaṃ vibhajantam āyoḥ |
Translation: 1. THIS day I bring God Savitar to meet you, and Bhaga who allots the wealth of mortals.

Sanskit Text: आ वां नरा पुरुभुजा वव्र्त्यां दिवे-दिवे चिद अश्विना सखीयन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ narā purubhujā vavṛtyāṃ dive-dive cid aśvinā sakhīyan ||
Translation: You, Aśvins, Heroes rich in treasures, daily seeking your friendship fain would I turn hither.

Sanskit Text: परति परयाणम असुरस्य विद्वान सूक्तैर देवं सवितारं दुवस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati prayāṇam asurasya vidvān sūktair devaṃ savitāraṃ duvasya |
Translation: 2 Knowing full well the Asura's time of coming, worship God Savitar with hymns and praises.

Sanskit Text: उप बरुवीत नमसा विजानञ जयेष्ठं च रत्नं विभजन्तम आयोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa bruvīta namasā vijānañ jyeṣṭhaṃ ca ratnaṃ vibhajantam āyoḥ ||
Translation: Let him who rightly knoweth speak with homage to him who dealeth out man's noblest treasure.

Sanskit Text: अदत्रया दयते वार्याणि पूषा भगो अदितिर वस्त उस्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adatrayā dayate vāryāṇi pūṣā bhagho aditir vasta usraḥ |
Translation: 3 Not for reward doth Pūṣan send his blessings, Bhaga, or Aditi: his garb is splendour.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो विष्णुर वरुणो मित्रो अग्निर अहानि भद्रा जनयन्त दस्माः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro viṣṇur varuṇo mitro aghnir ahāni bhadrā janayanta dasmāḥ ||
Translation: May Indra, Visniu, Varuṇa, Mitra, Agni produce auspicious days, the Wonder-Workers.

Sanskit Text: तन नो अनर्वा सविता वरूथं तत सिन्धव इषयन्तो अनु गमन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no anarvā savitā varūthaṃ tat sindhava iṣayanto anu ghman |
Translation: 4 Sending the shelter which we ask, the foeless Savitar and the Rivers shall approach us.

Sanskit Text: उप यद वोचे अध्वरस्य होता रायः सयाम पतयो वाजरत्नाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa yad voce adhvarasya hotā rāyaḥ syāma patayo vājaratnāḥ ||
Translation: When I, the sacrifice's priest, invite them, may we he lords of wealth and rich possessions.

Sanskit Text: पर ये वसुभ्य ईवद आ नमो दुर ये मित्रे वरुणे सूक्तवाचः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ye vasubhya īvad ā namo dur ye mitre varuṇe sūktavācaḥ |
Translation: 5 They who devote such worship to the Vasus, singing their hymns to Varuṇa and Mitra,

Sanskit Text: अवैत्व अभ्वं कर्णुता वरीयो दिवस्प्र्थिव्योर अवसा मदेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avaitv abhvaṃ kṛṇutā varīyo divaspṛthivyor avasā madema ||
Translation: Vouchsafe them ample room, far off be danger. Through grace of Heaven and Earth may we be happy.

Sanskit Text: विश्वो देवस्य नेतुर मर्तो वुरीत सख्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvo devasya netur marto vurīta sakhyam |
Translation: 1. LET every mortal man elect the friendship of the guiding God.

Sanskit Text: विश्वो राय इषुध्यति दयुम्नं वर्णीत पुष्यसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvo rāya iṣudhyati dyumnaṃ vṛṇīta puṣyase ||
Translation: Each one solicits him for wealth and seeks renown to prosper him.

Sanskit Text: ते ते देव नेतर ये चेमां अनुशसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te te deva netar ye cemāṃ anuśase |
Translation: 2 These, leading God, are thine, and these here ready to speak after us.

Sanskit Text: ते राया ते हय रप्र्चे सचेमहि सचथ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te rāyā te hy ṛpṛce sacemahi sacathyaḥ ||
Translation: As such may we attain to wealth and wait with services on thee.

Sanskit Text: अतो न आ नञ्न अतिथीन अतः पत्नीर दशस्यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ato na ā nñn atithīn ataḥ patnīr daśasyata |
Translation: 3 So further honour as our guests the Hero Gods and then the Dames.

Sanskit Text: आरे विश्वम पथेष्ठां दविषो युयोतु यूयुविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āre viśvam patheṣṭhāṃ dviṣo yuyotu yūyuviḥ ||
Translation: May he remove and keep afar our foes and all who block our path.

Sanskit Text: यत्र वह्निर अभिहितो दुद्रवद दरोण्यः पशुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatra vahnir abhihito dudravad droṇyaḥ paśuḥ |
Translation: 4 Where fire is set, and swiftly runs the victim dwelling in the trough,

Sanskit Text: नर्मणा वीरपस्त्यो ऽरणा धीरेव सनिता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛmaṇā vīrapastyo 'rṇā dhīreva sanitā ||
Translation: He wins, with heroes in his home, friendly to man, like constant streams.

Sanskit Text: एष ते देव नेता रथस्पतिः शं रयिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa te deva netā rathaspatiḥ śaṃ rayiḥ |
Translation: 5 May these thy riches, Leader God! that rule the car, be blest to us,

Sanskit Text: शं राये शं सवस्तय इषस्तुतो मनामहे देवस्तुतो मनामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ rāye śaṃ svastaya iṣastuto manāmahe devastuto manāmahe ||
Translation: Yea, blest to us for wealth and weal. This will we ponder praising strength, this ponder as we praise the God.

Sanskit Text: पर शयावाश्व धर्ष्णुयार्चा मरुद्भिर रक्वभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra śyāvāśva dhṛṣṇuyārcā marudbhir ṛkvabhiḥ |
Translation: 1. SING boldly forth, Śyāvāśva, with the Maruts who are loud in song,

Sanskit Text: ये अद्रोघम अनुष्वधं शरवो मदन्ति यज्ञियाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye adrogham anuṣvadhaṃ śravo madanti yajñiyāḥ ||
Translation: Who, holy, as their wont is, joy in glory that is free from guile.

Sanskit Text: ते हि सथिरस्य शवसः सखायः सन्ति धर्ष्णुया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te hi sthirasya śavasaḥ sakhāyaḥ santi dhṛṣṇuyā |
Translation: 2 For in their boldness they are friends of firm and sure heroic strength.

Sanskit Text: ते यामन्न आ धर्षद्विनस तमना पान्ति शश्वतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te yāmann ā dhṛṣadvinas tmanā pānti śaśvataḥ ||
Translation: They in their course, bold-spirited, guard all men of their own accord.

Sanskit Text: ते सयन्द्रासो नोक्षणो ऽति षकन्दन्ति शर्वरीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te syandrāso nokṣaṇo 'ti ṣkandanti śarvarīḥ |
Translation: 3 Like steers in rapid motion they advance and overtake the nights;

Sanskit Text: मरुताम अधा महो दिवि कषमा च मन्महे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: marutām adhā maho divi kṣamā ca manmahe ||
Translation: And thus the Maruts’ power in heaven and on the earth we celebrate.

Sanskit Text: मरुत्सु वो दधीमहि सतोमं यज्ञं च धर्ष्णुया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: marutsu vo dadhīmahi stomaṃ yajñaṃ ca dhṛṣṇuyā |
Translation: 4 With boldness to your Maruts let us offer laud and sacrifice:

Sanskit Text: विश्वे ये मानुषा युगा पान्ति मर्त्यं रिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve ye mānuṣā yughā pānti martyaṃ riṣaḥ ||
Translation: Who all, through ages of mankind, guard mortal man from injury.

Sanskit Text: अर्हन्तो ये सुदानवो नरो असामिशवसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arhanto ye sudānavo naro asāmiśavasaḥ |
Translation: 5 Praiseworthy, givers of good gifts, Heroes with full and perfect strength -

Sanskit Text: पर यज्ञं यज्ञियेभ्यो दिवो अर्चा मरुद्भ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yajñaṃ yajñiyebhyo divo arcā marudbhyaḥ ||
Translation: To Maruts, Holy Ones of heaven, will I extol the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: आ रुक्मैर आ युधा नर रष्वा रष्टीर अस्र्क्षत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā rukmair ā yudhā nara ṛṣvā ṛṣṭīr asṛkṣata |
Translation: 6 The lofty Heroes cast their spears and weapons bright with gleaming gold.

Sanskit Text: अन्व एनां अह विद्युतो मरुतो जज्झतीर इव भानुर अर्त तमना दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anv enāṃ aha vidyuto maruto jajjhatīr iva bhānur arta tmanā divaḥ ||
Translation: After these Maruts followed close, like laughing lightning from the sky, a splendour of its own accord.

Sanskit Text: ये वाव्र्धन्त पार्थिवा य उराव अन्तरिक्ष आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye vāvṛdhanta pārthivā ya urāv antarikṣa ā |
Translation: 7 They who waxed mighty, of the earth, they who are in the wide mid-air,

Sanskit Text: वर्जने वा नदीनां सधस्थे वा महो दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛjane vā nadīnāṃ sadhasthe vā maho divaḥ ||
Translation: Or in the rivers’ compass, or in the abode of ample heaven.

Sanskit Text: शर्धो मारुतम उच छंस सत्यशवसम रभ्वसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śardho mārutam uc chaṃsa satyaśavasam ṛbhvasam |
Translation: 8 Praise thou the Maruts’ company, the valorous and truly strong,

Sanskit Text: उत सम ते शुभे नरः पर सयन्द्रा युजत तमना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta sma te śubhe naraḥ pra syandrā yujata tmanā ||
Translation: The Heroes, hasting, by themselves have yoked their deer for victory.

Sanskit Text: उत सम ते परुष्ण्याम ऊर्णा वसत शुन्ध्यवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta sma te paruṣṇyām ūrṇā vasata śundhyavaḥ |
Translation: 9 Fair-gleaming, on Paruṣṇī they have clothed themselves in robes of wool,

Sanskit Text: उत पव्या रथानाम अद्रिम भिन्दन्त्य ओजसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta pavyā rathānām adrim bhindanty ojasā ||
Translation: And with their chariot tires they cleave the rock asunder in their might.

Sanskit Text: आपथयो विपथयो ऽनतस्पथा अनुपथाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpathayo vipathayo 'ntaspathā anupathāḥ |
Translation: 10 Whether as wanderers from the way or speeders on or to the path,

Sanskit Text: एतेभिर मह्यं नामभिर यज्ञं विष्टार ओहते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: etebhir mahyaṃ nāmabhir yajñaṃ viṣṭāra ohate ||
Translation: Under these names the spreading band tend well the sacrifice for me.

Sanskit Text: अधा नरो नय ओहते ऽधा नियुत ओहते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā naro ny ohate 'dhā niyuta ohate |
Translation: 11 To this the Heroes well attend, well do their teams attend to this.

Sanskit Text: अधा पारावता इति चित्रा रूपाणि दर्श्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā pārāvatā iti citrā rūpāṇi darśyā ||
Translation: Visible are their varied forms. Behold, they are Paravatas.

Sanskit Text: छन्दस्तुभः कुभन्यव उत्सम आ कीरिणो नर्तुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: chandastubhaḥ kubhanyava utsam ā kīriṇo nṛtuḥ |
Translation: 12 Hymn-singing, seeking water, they, praising, have danced about the spring.

Sanskit Text: ते मे के चिन न तायव ऊमा आसन दर्शि तविषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te me ke cin na tāyava ūmā āsan dṛśi tviṣe ||
Translation: What are they unto me? No thieves, but helpers, splendid to behold.

Sanskit Text: य रष्वा रष्टिविद्युतः कवयः सन्ति वेधसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya ṛṣvā ṛṣṭividyutaḥ kavayaḥ santi vedhasaḥ |
Translation: 13 Sublime, with lightnings for their spears, Sages and Orderers are they.

Sanskit Text: तम रषे मारुतं गणं नमस्या रमया गिरा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tam ṛṣe mārutaṃ ghaṇaṃ namasyā ramayā ghirā ||
Translation: Ṛṣi, adore that Marut host, and make them happy with thy song.

Sanskit Text: अछ रषे मारुतं गणं दाना मित्रं न योषणा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: acha ṛṣe mārutaṃ ghaṇaṃ dānā mitraṃ na yoṣaṇā |
Translation: 14 Ṛṣi, invite the Marut band with offerings, as a maid her friend.

Sanskit Text: दिवो वा धर्ष्णव ओजसा सतुता धीभिर इषण्यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo vā dhṛṣṇava ojasā stutā dhībhir iṣaṇyata ||
Translation: From heaven, too, Bold Ones, in your might haste hither glorified with songs.

Sanskit Text: नू मन्वान एषां देवां अछा न वक्षणा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū manvāna eṣāṃ devāṃ achā na vakṣaṇā |
Translation: 15 Thinking of these now let him come, as with the escort of the Gods,

Sanskit Text: दाना सचेत सूरिभिर यामश्रुतेभिर अञ्जिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dānā saceta sūribhir yāmaśrutebhir añjibhiḥ ||
Translation: And with the splendid Princes, famed for rapid courses, to the gifts.

Sanskit Text: पर ये मे बन्ध्वेषे गां वोचन्त सूरयः पर्श्निं वोचन्त मातरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ye me bandhveṣe ghāṃ vocanta sūrayaḥ pṛśniṃ vocanta mātaram |
Translation: 16 Princes, who, when I asked their kin, named Pṛśni as their Mother-cow,

Sanskit Text: अधा पितरम इष्मिणं रुद्रं वोचन्त शिक्वसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā pitaram iṣmiṇaṃ rudraṃ vocanta śikvasaḥ ||
Translation: And the impetuous Rudra they, the Mighty Ones, declared their Sire.

Sanskit Text: सप्त मे सप्त शाकिन एकम-एका शता ददुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sapta me sapta śākina ekam-ekā śatā daduḥ |
Translation: 17 The mighty ones, the seven times seven, have singly given me hundred gifts.

Sanskit Text: यमुनायाम अधि शरुतम उद राधो गव्यम मर्जे नि राधो अश्व्यम मर्जे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamunāyām adhi śrutam ud rādho ghavyam mṛje ni rādho aśvyam mṛje ||
Translation: I have obtained on Yamuna famed wealth in kine and wealth in steeds.

Sanskit Text: को वेद जानम एषां को वा पुरा सुम्नेष्व आस मरुताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko veda jānam eṣāṃ ko vā purā sumneṣv āsa marutām |
Translation: 1. Who knows the birth of these, or who lived in the Maruts’ favour in the days of old

Sanskit Text: यद युयुज्रे किलास्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad yuyujre kilāsyaḥ ||
Translation: What time their spotted deer were yoked?

Sanskit Text: ऐतान रथेषु तस्थुषः कः शुश्राव कथा ययुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aitān ratheṣu tasthuṣaḥ kaḥ śuśrāva kathā yayuḥ |
Translation: 2 Who, when they stood upon their cars, hath heard them tell the way they went?

Sanskit Text: कस्मै सस्रुः सुदासे अन्व आपय इळाभिर वर्ष्टयः सह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kasmai sasruḥ sudāse anv āpaya iḷābhir vṛṣṭayaḥ saha ||
Translation: Who was the bounteous man to whom their kindred rains flowed down with food of sacrifice?

Sanskit Text: ते म आहुर य आययुर उप दयुभिर विभिर मदे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te ma āhur ya āyayur upa dyubhir vibhir made |
Translation: 3 To me they told it, and they came with winged steeds radiant to the draught,

Sanskit Text: नरो मर्या अरेपस इमान पश्यन्न इति षटुहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: naro maryā arepasa imān paśyann iti ṣṭuhi ||
Translation: Youths, Heroes free from spot or stain: Behold us here and praise thou us;

Sanskit Text: ये अञ्जिषु ये वाशीषु सवभानवः सरक्षु रुक्मेषु खादिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye añjiṣu ye vāśīṣu svabhānavaḥ srakṣu rukmeṣu khādiṣu |
Translation: 4 Who shine self-luminous with ornaments and swords, with breastplates, armlets, and with wreaths,

Sanskit Text: शराया रथेषु धन्वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrāyā ratheṣu dhanvasu ||
Translation: Arrayed on chariots and with bows.

Sanskit Text: युष्माकं समा रथां अनु मुदे दधे मरुतो जीरदानवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmākaṃ smā rathāṃ anu mude dadhe maruto jīradānavaḥ |
Translation: 5 O swift to pour your bounties down, ye Maruts, with delight I look upon your cars,

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्टी दयावो यतीर इव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṭī dyāvo yatīr iva ||
Translation: Like splendours coming through the rain.

Sanskit Text: आ यं नरः सुदानवो ददाशुषे दिवः कोशम अचुच्यवुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yaṃ naraḥ sudānavo dadāśuṣe divaḥ kośam acucyavuḥ |
Translation: 6 Munificent Heroes, they have cast heaven's treasury down for the worshipper's behoof:

Sanskit Text: वि पर्जन्यं सर्जन्ति रोदसी अनु धन्वना यन्ति वर्ष्टयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi parjanyaṃ sṛjanti rodasī anu dhanvanā yanti vṛṣṭayaḥ ||
Translation: They set the storm-cloud free to stream through both the worlds, and rainfloods flow o’er desert spots.

Sanskit Text: तत्र्दानाः सिन्धवः कषोदसा रजः पर सस्रुर धेनवो यथा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tatṛdānāḥ sindhavaḥ kṣodasā rajaḥ pra sasrur dhenavo yathā |
Translation: 7 The bursting streams m billowy flood have spread abroad, like milch-kine, o’er the firmament.

Sanskit Text: सयन्ना अश्वा इवाध्वनो विमोचने वि यद वर्तन्त एन्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: syannā aśvā ivādhvano vimocane vi yad vartanta enyaḥ ||
Translation: Like swift steeds hasting to their journey's resting-place, to every side run glittering brooks.

Sanskit Text: आ यात मरुतो दिव आन्तरिक्षाद अमाद उत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yāta maruto diva āntarikṣād amād uta |
Translation: 8 Hither, O Maruts, come from heaven, from mid-air, or from near at hand

Sanskit Text: माव सथात परावतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: māva sthāta parāvataḥ ||
Translation: Tarry not far away from us.

Sanskit Text: मा वो रसानितभा कुभा करुमुर मा वः सिन्धुर नि रीरमत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā vo rasānitabhā kubhā krumur mā vaḥ sindhur ni rīramat |
Translation: 9 So let not Rasā, Krumu, or Anitabha, Kubha, or Sindhu hold you back.

Sanskit Text: मा वः परि षठात सरयुः पुरीषिण्य अस्मे ईत सुम्नम अस्तु वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā vaḥ pari ṣṭhāt sarayuḥ purīṣiṇy asme īt sumnam astu vaḥ ||
Translation: Let not the watery Sarayti obstruct your way. With us be all the bliss ye give.

Sanskit Text: तं वः शर्धं रथानां तवेषं गणम मारुतं नव्यसीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vaḥ śardhaṃ rathānāṃ tveṣaṃ ghaṇam mārutaṃ navyasīnām |
Translation: 10 That brilliant gathering of your cars, the company of Maruts, of the Youthful Ones,

Sanskit Text: अनु पर यन्ति वर्ष्टयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu pra yanti vṛṣṭayaḥ ||
Translation: The rain-showers, speeding on, attend.

Sanskit Text: शर्धं-शर्धं व एषां वरातं-वरातं गणं-गणं सुशस्तिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śardhaṃ-śardhaṃ va eṣāṃ vrātaṃ-vrātaṃ ghaṇaṃ-ghaṇaṃ suśastibhiḥ |
Translation: 11 With eulogies and hymns may we follow your army, troop by troop, and band by band,

Sanskit Text: अनु करामेम धीतिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu krāmema dhītibhiḥ ||
Translation: And company by company.

Sanskit Text: कस्मा अद्य सुजाताय रातहव्याय पर ययुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kasmā adya sujātāya rātahavyāya pra yayuḥ |
Translation: 12 To what oblation-giver, sprung of noble ancestry, have sped

Sanskit Text: एना यामेन मरुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: enā yāmena marutaḥ ||
Translation: The Maruts on this course to-day?

Sanskit Text: येन तोकाय तनयाय धान्यम बीजं वहध्वे अक्षितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena tokāya tanayāya dhānyam bījaṃ vahadhve akṣitam |
Translation: 13 Vouchsafe to us the bounty, that which we implore, through which, for child and progeny,

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं तद धत्तन यद व ईमहे राधो विश्वायु सौभगम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ tad dhattana yad va īmahe rādho viśvāyu saubhagham ||
Translation: Ye give the seed of corn that wasteth not away, and bliss that reacheth to all life.

Sanskit Text: अतीयाम निदस तिरः सवस्तिभिर हित्वावद्यम अरातीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atīyāma nidas tiraḥ svastibhir hitvāvadyam arātīḥ |
Translation: 14 May we in safety pass by those who slander us, leaving behind disgrace and hate.

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्ट्वी शं योर आप उस्रि भेषजं सयाम मरुतः सह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṭvī śaṃ yor āpa usri bheṣajaṃ syāma marutaḥ saha ||
Translation: Maruts, may we be there when ye, at dawn, in rest and toil, rain waters down and balm.

Sanskit Text: सुदेवः समहासति सुवीरो नरो मरुतः स मर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sudevaḥ samahāsati suvīro naro marutaḥ sa martyaḥ |
Translation: 15 Favoured by Gods shall he the man, O Heroes, Marutr! and possessed of noble sons,

Sanskit Text: यं तरायध्वे सयाम ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ trāyadhve syāma te ||
Translation: Whom ye protect. Such may we be.

Sanskit Text: सतुहि भोजान सतुवतो अस्य यामनि रणन गावो न यवसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stuhi bhojān stuvato asya yāmani raṇan ghāvo na yavase |
Translation: 16 Praise the Free-givers. At this liberal patron's rite they joy like cattle in the mead.

Sanskit Text: यतः पूर्वां इव सखींर अनु हवय गिरा गर्णीहि कामिनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yataḥ pūrvāṃ iva sakhīṃr anu hvaya ghirā ghṛṇīhi kāminaḥ ||
Translation: So call thou unto them who come as ancient Friends: hymn those who love thee with a song.

Sanskit Text: पर शर्धाय मारुताय सवभानव इमां वाचम अनजा पर्वतच्युते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra śardhāya mārutāya svabhānava imāṃ vācam anajā parvatacyute |
Translation: 1. THIS hymn will I make for the Marut host who bright in native splendour cast the mountains down.

Sanskit Text: घर्मस्तुभे दिव आ पर्ष्ठयज्वने दयुम्नश्रवसे महि नर्म्णम अर्चत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: gharmastubhe diva ā pṛṣṭhayajvane dyumnaśravase mahi nṛmṇam arcata ||
Translation: Sing the great strength of those illustrious in renown, who stay the heat, who sacrifice on heights of heaven.

Sanskit Text: पर वो मरुतस तविषा उदन्यवो वयोव्र्धो अश्वयुजः परिज्रयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vo marutas taviṣā udanyavo vayovṛdho aśvayujaḥ parijrayaḥ |
Translation: 2 O Maruts, rich in water, strengtheners of life are your strong bands with harnessed steeds, that wander far.

Sanskit Text: सं विद्युता दधति वाशति तरितः सवरन्त्य आपो ऽवना परिज्रयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ vidyutā dadhati vāśati tritaḥ svaranty āpo 'vanā parijrayaḥ ||
Translation: Trita roars out at him who aims the lightning-flash. The waters sweeping round are thundering on their way.

Sanskit Text: विद्युन्महसो नरो अश्मदिद्यवो वातत्विषो मरुतः पर्वतच्युतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidyunmahaso naro aśmadidyavo vātatviṣo marutaḥ parvatacyutaḥ |
Translation: 3 They gleam with lightning, Heroes, Casters of the Stone, wind-rapid Maruts, overthrowers of the bills,

Sanskit Text: अब्दया चिन मुहुर आ हरादुनीव्र्त सतनयदमा रभसा उदोजसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abdayā cin muhur ā hrādunīvṛta stanayadamā rabhasā udojasaḥ ||
Translation: Oft through desire to rain coming with storm of hail, roaring in onset, violent and exceeding strong.

Sanskit Text: वय अक्तून रुद्रा वय अहानि शिक्वसो वय अन्तरिक्षं वि रजांसि धूतयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vy aktūn rudrā vy ahāni śikvaso vy antarikṣaṃ vi rajāṃsi dhūtayaḥ |
Translation: 4 When, mighty Rudras, through the nights and through the days, when through the sky and realms of air, shakers of all,

Sanskit Text: वि यद अज्रां अजथ नाव ईं यथा वि दुर्गाणि मरुतो नाह रिष्यथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yad ajrāṃ ajatha nāva īṃ yathā vi durghāṇi maruto nāha riṣyatha ||
Translation: When over the broad fields ye drive along like ships, e’en to strongholds ye come, Maruts, but are not harmed.

Sanskit Text: तद वीर्यं वो मरुतो महित्वनं दीर्घं ततान सूर्यो न योजनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad vīryaṃ vo maruto mahitvanaṃ dīrghaṃ tatāna sūryo na yojanam |
Translation: 5 Maruts, this hero strength and majesty of yours hath, like the Sun, extended o’er a lengthened way,

Sanskit Text: एता न यामे अग्र्भीतशोचिषो ऽनश्वदां यन नय अयातना गिरिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: etā na yāme aghṛbhītaśociṣo 'naśvadāṃ yan ny ayātanā ghirim ||
Translation: When in your course like deer with splendour unsubdued ye bowed the hill that gives imperishable rain.

Sanskit Text: अभ्राजि शर्धो मरुतो यद अर्णसम मोषथा वर्क्षं कपनेव वेधसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhrāji śardho maruto yad arṇasam moṣathā vṛkṣaṃ kapaneva vedhasaḥ |
Translation: 6 Bright shone your host, ye Sages, Maruts, when ye smote the waving tree as when the worm consumeth it.

Sanskit Text: अध समा नो अरमतिं सजोषसश चक्षुर इव यन्तम अनु नेषथा सुगम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha smā no aramatiṃ sajoṣasaś cakṣur iva yantam anu neṣathā sugham ||
Translation: Accordant, as the eye guides him who walks, have ye led our devotion onward by an easy path.

Sanskit Text: न स जीयते मरुतो न हन्यते न सरेधति न वयथते न रिष्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na sa jīyate maruto na hanyate na sredhati na vyathate na riṣyati |
Translation: 7 Never is he, O Maruts, slain or overcome, never doth he decay ne’er is distressed or harmed;

Sanskit Text: नास्य राय उप दस्यन्ति नोतय रषिं वा यं राजानं वा सुषूदथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāsya rāya upa dasyanti notaya ṛṣiṃ vā yaṃ rājānaṃ vā suṣūdatha ||
Translation: His treasures, his resources, never waste away, whom. whether he be prince or Ṛṣi, ye direct.

Sanskit Text: नियुत्वन्तो गरामजितो यथा नरो ऽरयमणो न मरुतः कबन्धिनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: niyutvanto ghrāmajito yathā naro 'ryamaṇo na marutaḥ kabandhinaḥ |
Translation: 8 With harnessed team like heroes overcoming troops, the friendly Maruts, laden with their water-casks,

Sanskit Text: पिन्वन्त्य उत्सं यद इनासो अस्वरन वय उन्दन्ति पर्थिवीम मध्वो अन्धसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pinvanty utsaṃ yad ināso asvaran vy undanti pṛthivīm madhvo andhasā ||
Translation: Let the spring flow, and when impetuous' they roar they inundate the earth with floods of pleasant meath.

Sanskit Text: परवत्वतीयम पर्थिवी मरुद्भ्यः परवत्वती दयौर भवति परयद्भ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pravatvatīyam pṛthivī marudbhyaḥ pravatvatī dyaur bhavati prayadbhyaḥ |
Translation: 9 Free for the Maruts is the earth with sloping ways, free for the rushing Ones is heaven with steep descents.

Sanskit Text: परवत्वतीः पथ्य्र अन्तरिक्ष्याः परवत्वन्तः पर्वता जीरदानवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pravatvatīḥ pathyṛ antarikṣyāḥ pravatvantaḥ parvatā jīradānavaḥ ||
Translation: The paths of air's mid-region are precipitous, precipitous the mountains with their running streams.

Sanskit Text: यन मरुतः सभरसः सवर्णरः सूर्य उदिते मदथा दिवो नरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yan marutaḥ sabharasaḥ svarṇaraḥ sūrya udite madathā divo naraḥ |
Translation: 10 When, as the Sun hath risen up, ye take delight, O bounteous radiant Maruts, Heroes of the sky,

Sanskit Text: न वो ऽशवाः शरथयन्ताह सिस्रतः सद्यो अस्याध्वनः पारम अश्नुथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na vo 'śvāḥ śrathayantāha sisrataḥ sadyo asyādhvanaḥ pāram aśnutha ||
Translation: Your coursers weary not when speeding onṭheir way, and rapidly ye reach the end of this your path.

Sanskit Text: अंसेषु व रष्टयः पत्सु खादयो वक्षस्सु रुक्मा मरुतो रथे शुभः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṃseṣu va ṛṣṭayaḥ patsu khādayo vakṣassu rukmā maruto rathe śubhaḥ |
Translation: 11 Lances are on your shoulders, anklets on your feet, gold chains are on your breasts, gems, Maruts, on your car.

Sanskit Text: अग्निभ्राजसो विद्युतो गभस्त्योः शिप्राः शीर्षसु वितता हिरण्ययीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnibhrājaso vidyuto ghabhastyoḥ śiprāḥ śīrṣasu vitatā hiraṇyayīḥ ||
Translation: Lightnings aglow with flame are flashing in your hands, and visors wroughtof gold are laid upon your heads.

Sanskit Text: तं नाकम अर्यो अग्र्भीतशोचिषं रुशत पिप्पलम मरुतो वि धूनुथ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ nākam aryo aghṛbhītaśociṣaṃ ruśat pippalam maruto vi dhūnutha |
Translation: 12 Maruts, in eager stir ye shake the vault of heaven, splendid beyond conception, for its shining fruit.

Sanskit Text: सम अच्यन्त वर्जनातित्विषन्त यत सवरन्ति घोषं विततम रतायवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sam acyanta vṛjanātitviṣanta yat svaranti ghoṣaṃ vitatam ṛtāyavaḥ ||
Translation: They gathered when they let their deeds of might flash forth. The Pious Ones send forth a far-resounding shout.

Sanskit Text: युष्मादत्तस्य मरुतो विचेतसो रायः सयाम रथ्यो वयस्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmādattasya maruto vicetaso rāyaḥ syāma rathyo vayasvataḥ |
Translation: 13 Sage Maruts, may we be the drivers of the car of riches ful I of life that have been given by you.

Sanskit Text: न यो युछति तिष्यो यथा दिवो ऽसमे रारन्त मरुतः सहस्रिणम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yo yuchati tiṣyo yathā divo 'sme rāranta marutaḥ sahasriṇam ||
Translation: O Maruts, let that wealth in thousands dwell with us which never vanishes like Tisya from the sky.

Sanskit Text: यूयं रयिम मरुत सपार्हवीरं यूयम रषिम अवथ सामविप्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyaṃ rayim maruta spārhavīraṃ yūyam ṛṣim avatha sāmavipram |
Translation: 14 Maruts, ye further wealth with longedfor heroes, further the Ṛṣi skilled in chanted verses.

Sanskit Text: यूयम अर्वन्तम भरताय वाजं यूयं धत्थ राजानं शरुष्टिमन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyam arvantam bharatāya vājaṃ yūyaṃ dhattha rājānaṃ śruṣṭimantam ||
Translation: Ye give the Bhārata as his strength, a charger, and ye bestow a king who quickly listens.

Sanskit Text: तद वो यामि दरविणं सद्यूतयो येना सवर ण ततनाम नॄंर अभि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad vo yāmi draviṇaṃ sadyaūtayo yenā svar ṇa tatanāma nṝṃr abhi |
Translation: 15 Of you, most swift to succour! I solicit wealth wherewith we may spread forth mid men like as the Sun.

Sanskit Text: इदं सु मे मरुतो हर्यता वचो यस्य तरेम तरसा शतं हिमाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ su me maruto haryatā vaco yasya tarema tarasā śataṃ himāḥ ||
Translation: Accept, O Maruts, graciously this hymn of mine that we may live a hundred winters through its power.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने शर्धन्तम आ गणम पिष्टं रुक्मेभिर अञ्जिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne śardhantam ā ghaṇam piṣṭaṃ rukmebhir añjibhiḥ |
Translation: 1. AGNI, that valorous company adorned with ornaments of gold,

Sanskit Text: विशो अद्य मरुताम अव हवये दिवश चिद रोचनाद अधि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśo adya marutām ava hvaye divaś cid rocanād adhi ||
Translation: The people of the Maruts, I call down to-day even from the luminous realm of heaven.

Sanskit Text: यथा चिन मन्यसे हर्दा तद इन मे जग्मुर आशसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā cin manyase hṛdā tad in me jaghmur āśasaḥ |
Translation: 2 Even as thou thinkest in thy heart, thither my wishes also tend.

Sanskit Text: ये ते नेदिष्ठं हवनान्य आगमन तान वर्ध भीमसंद्र्शः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye te nediṣṭhaṃ havanāny āghaman tān vardha bhīmasaṃdṛśaḥ ||
Translation: Those who have come most near to thine invoking calls, strengthen them fearful to behold.

Sanskit Text: मीळ्हुष्मतीव पर्थिवी पराहता मदन्त्य एत्य अस्मद आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mīḷhuṣmatīva pṛthivī parāhatā madanty ety asmad ā |
Translation: 3 Earth, like a bounteous lady, liberal of her gifts, struck down and shaken, yet exultant, comes to us.

Sanskit Text: रक्षो न वो मरुतः शिमीवां अमो दुध्रो गौर इव भीमयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛkṣo na vo marutaḥ śimīvāṃ amo dudhro ghaur iva bhīmayuḥ ||
Translation: Impetuous as a bear, O Maruts, is youi rush terrible as a dreadful bull..

Sanskit Text: नि ये रिणन्त्य ओजसा वर्था गावो न दुर्धुरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni ye riṇanty ojasā vṛthā ghāvo na durdhuraḥ |
Translation: 4 They who with mighty strength o’erthrow like oxen difficult to yoke,

Sanskit Text: अश्मानं चित सवर्यम पर्वतं गिरिम पर चयावयन्ति यामभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśmānaṃ cit svaryam parvataṃ ghirim pra cyāvayanti yāmabhiḥ ||
Translation: Cause e’en the heavenly stone to shake ' yea, shake the rocky mountain as they race along.

Sanskit Text: उत तिष्ठ नूनम एषां सतोमैः समुक्षितानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut tiṣṭha nūnam eṣāṃ stomaiḥ samukṣitānām |
Translation: 5 Rise up! even now with lauds I call the very numerous company,

Sanskit Text: मरुताम पुरुतमम अपूर्व्यं गवां सर्गम इव हवये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: marutām purutamam apūrvyaṃ ghavāṃ sargham iva hvaye ||
Translation: Unequalled, of these Maruts, like a herd of kine, grown up together in their strength.

Sanskit Text: युङगध्वं हय अरुषी रथे युङगध्वं रथेषु रोहितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṅghdhvaṃ hy aruṣī rathe yuṅghdhvaṃ ratheṣu rohitaḥ |
Translation: 6 Bind to your car the bright red mares, yoke the red coursers to your car.

Sanskit Text: युङगध्वं हरी अजिरा धुरि वोळ्हवे वहिष्ठा धुरि वोळ्हवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṅghdhvaṃ harī ajirā dhuri voḷhave vahiṣṭhā dhuri voḷhave ||
Translation: Bind to the pole, to draw, the fleet-foot tawny steeds, the best at drawing, to the pole.

Sanskit Text: उत सय वाज्य अरुषस तुविष्वणिर इह सम धायि दर्शतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta sya vājy aruṣas tuviṣvaṇir iha sma dhāyi darśataḥ |
Translation: 7 Yea, and this loudly-neighing bright red vigorous horse who hath been sutioned, fair to see,

Sanskit Text: मा वो यामेषु मरुतश चिरं करत पर तं रथेषु चोदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā vo yāmeṣu marutaś ciraṃ karat pra taṃ ratheṣu codata ||
Translation: Let him not cause delay, O Maruts,, in your course, urge ye him onward in your cars.

Sanskit Text: रथं नु मारुतं वयं शरवस्युम आ हुवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathaṃ nu mārutaṃ vayaṃ śravasyum ā huvāmahe |
Translation: 8 The Maruts’ chariot, ever fain to gather glory, we invoke,

Sanskit Text: आ यस्मिन तस्थौ सुरणानि बिभ्रती सचा मरुत्सु रोदसी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yasmin tasthau suraṇāni bibhratī sacā marutsu rodasī ||
Translation: Which Rodasī hath mounted, bringing pleasant gifts, with Maruts in her company.

Sanskit Text: तं वः शर्धं रथेशुभं तवेषम पनस्युम आ हुवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vaḥ śardhaṃ ratheśubhaṃ tveṣam panasyum ā huve |
Translation: 9 I call that brilliant band of yours, adorable, rapid on the car

Sanskit Text: यस्मिन सुजाता सुभगा महीयते सचा मरुत्सु मीळ्हुषी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasmin sujātā subhaghā mahīyate sacā marutsu mīḷhuṣī ||
Translation: Whereon the bounteous Dame, auspicious, nobly born, shows glorious with the Marut host.

Sanskit Text: आ रुद्रास इन्द्रवन्तः सजोषसो हिरण्यरथाः सुविताय गन्तन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā rudrāsa indravantaḥ sajoṣaso hiraṇyarathāḥ suvitāya ghantana |
Translation: 1. OF one accord, with Indra, O ye Rudras, come borne on your golden car for our prosperity.

Sanskit Text: इयं वो अस्मत परति हर्यते मतिस तर्ष्णजे न दिव उत्सा उदन्यवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyaṃ vo asmat prati haryate matis tṛṣṇaje na diva utsā udanyave ||
Translation: An offering from us, this hymn is brought to you, as, unto one who th irsts for water, heavenly springs.

Sanskit Text: वाशीमन्त रष्टिमन्तो मनीषिणः सुधन्वान इषुमन्तो निषङगिणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāśīmanta ṛṣṭimanto manīṣiṇaḥ sudhanvāna iṣumanto niṣaṅghiṇaḥ |
Translation: 2 Armed with your daggers, full of wisdom, armed with spears, armed with your quivers, armed with arrows, with good bows,

Sanskit Text: सवश्वा सथ सुरथाः पर्श्निमातरः सवायुधा मरुतो याथना शुभम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svaśvā stha surathāḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ svāyudhā maruto yāthanā śubham ||
