Translation: Good horses and good cars have ye, O Pṛśni's Sons: ye, Maruts, with good weapons go to victory.

Sanskit Text: धूनुथ दयाम पर्वतान दाशुषे वसु नि वो वना जिहते यामनो भिया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhūnutha dyām parvatān dāśuṣe vasu ni vo vanā jihate yāmano bhiyā |
Translation: 3 From hills and heaven ye shake wealth for the worshipper: in terror at your coming low the woods bow down.

Sanskit Text: कोपयथ पर्थिवीम पर्श्निमातरः शुभे यद उग्राः पर्षतीर अयुग्ध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kopayatha pṛthivīm pṛśnimātaraḥ śubhe yad ughrāḥ pṛṣatīr ayughdhvam ||
Translation: Ye make the earth to tremble, Sons of Pṛśni, when for victory ye have yoked, fierce Ones! your spotted deer.

Sanskit Text: वातत्विषो मरुतो वर्षनिर्णिजो यमा इव सुसद्र्शः सुपेशसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vātatviṣo maruto varṣanirṇijo yamā iva susadṛśaḥ supeśasaḥ |
Translation: 4 Bright with the blasts of wind, wrapped in their robes of rain, like twins of noble aspect and of lovely form,

Sanskit Text: पिशङगाश्वा अरुणाश्वा अरेपसः परत्वक्षसो महिना दयौर इवोरवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: piśaṅghāśvā aruṇāśvā arepasaḥ pratvakṣaso mahinā dyaur ivoravaḥ ||
Translation: The Maruts, spotless, with steeds tawnyhued and red, strong in their mightiness and spreading wide like heaven.

Sanskit Text: पुरुद्रप्सा अञ्जिमन्तः सुदानवस तवेषसंद्र्शो अनवभ्रराधसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purudrapsā añjimantaḥ sudānavas tveṣasaṃdṛśo anavabhrarādhasaḥ |
Translation: 5 Rich in adornment, rich in drops, munificent, bright in their aspect, yielding bounties that endure,

Sanskit Text: सुजातासो जनुषा रुक्मवक्षसो दिवो अर्का अम्र्तं नाम भेजिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sujātāso januṣā rukmavakṣaso divo arkā amṛtaṃ nāma bhejire ||
Translation: Noble by birth, adorned with gold upon their breasts, the Singers of the sky have won immortal fame.

Sanskit Text: रष्टयो वो मरुतो अंसयोर अधि सह ओजो बाह्वोर वो बलं हितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṣṭayo vo maruto aṃsayor adhi saha ojo bāhvor vo balaṃ hitam |
Translation: 6 Borne on both shoulders, O ye Maruts, are your spears: within your arms is laid your energy and 3trength.

Sanskit Text: नर्म्णा शीर्षस्व आयुधा रथेषु वो विश्वा वः शरीर अधि तनूषु पिपिशे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛmṇā śīrṣasv āyudhā ratheṣu vo viśvā vaḥ śrīr adhi tanūṣu pipiśe ||
Translation: Bold thoughts are in your heads, your weapons in your cars, all glorious majesty is moulded on your forms.

Sanskit Text: गोमद अश्वावद रथवत सुवीरं चन्द्रवद राधो मरुतो ददा नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghomad aśvāvad rathavat suvīraṃ candravad rādho maruto dadā naḥ |
Translation: 7 Vouchsafe to us, O Maruts, splendid bounty in cattle and in steeds, in cars and heroes.

Sanskit Text: परशस्तिं नः कर्णुत रुद्रियासो भक्षीय वो ऽवसो दैव्यस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: praśastiṃ naḥ kṛṇuta rudriyāso bhakṣīya vo 'vaso daivyasya ||
Translation: Children of Rudra, give us high distinction: may I enjoy your Godlike help and favour.

Sanskit Text: हये नरो मरुतो मर्ळता नस तुवीमघासो अम्र्ता रतज्ञाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: haye naro maruto mṛḷatā nas tuvīmaghāso amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ |
Translation: 8 Ho! Maruts, Heroes, skilled in Law, immortal, be gracious unto us, ye rich in treasures,

Sanskit Text: सत्यश्रुतः कवयो युवानो बर्हद्गिरयो बर्हद उक्षमाणाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satyaśrutaḥ kavayo yuvāno bṛhadghirayo bṛhad ukṣamāṇāḥ ||
Translation: Ye hearers of the truth, ye sage and youthful, grown mighty, dwelling on the lofty mountains.

Sanskit Text: तम उ नूनं तविषीमन्तम एषां सतुषे गणम मारुतं नव्यसीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tam u nūnaṃ taviṣīmantam eṣāṃ stuṣe ghaṇam mārutaṃ navyasīnām |
Translation: 1. Now do I glorify their mighty cohort, the company of these the youthful Maruts,

Sanskit Text: य आश्वश्वा अमवद वहन्त उतेशिरे अम्र्तस्य सवराजः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya āśvaśvā amavad vahanta uteśire amṛtasya svarājaḥ ||
Translation: Who ride impetuous on with rapid horses, and radiant in themselves, are Lords of Amṛta.

Sanskit Text: तवेषं गणं तवसं खादिहस्तं धुनिव्रतम मायिनं दातिवारम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tveṣaṃ ghaṇaṃ tavasaṃ khādihastaṃ dhunivratam māyinaṃ dātivāram |
Translation: 2 The mighty glittering band, arm-bound with bracelets, givers of bliss, unmeasured in their greatness,

Sanskit Text: मयोभुवो ये अमिता महित्वा वन्दस्व विप्र तुविराधसो नॄन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mayobhuvo ye amitā mahitvā vandasva vipra tuvirādhaso nṝn ||
Translation: With magical powers, bountiful, ever-roaring,—these, liberal Heroes, venerate thou singer.

Sanskit Text: आ वो यन्तूदवाहासो अद्य वर्ष्टिं ये विश्वे मरुतो जुनन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vo yantūdavāhāso adya vṛṣṭiṃ ye viśve maruto junanti |
Translation: 3 This day may all your water-bringers, Maruts, they who impel the falling rain, approach us.

Sanskit Text: अयं यो अग्निर मरुतः समिद्ध एतं जुषध्वं कवयो युवानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ yo aghnir marutaḥ samiddha etaṃ juṣadhvaṃ kavayo yuvānaḥ ||
Translation: This fire, O Maruts, hath been duly kindled; let it find favour with you, youthful Sages.

Sanskit Text: यूयं राजानम इर्यं जनाय विभ्वतष्टं जनयथा यजत्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyaṃ rājānam iryaṃ janāya vibhvataṣṭaṃ janayathā yajatrāḥ |
Translation: 4 Ye raise up for the folk an active ruler whom, Holy Ones! a Master's hand hath fashioned.

Sanskit Text: युष्मद एति मुष्टिहा बाहुजूतो युष्मद सदश्वो मरुतः सुवीरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmad eti muṣṭihā bāhujūto yuṣmad sadaśvo marutaḥ suvīraḥ ||
Translation: Ye send the fighter hand to hand, armmighty, and the brave hero, Maruts with good horses.

Sanskit Text: अरा इवेद अचरमा अहेव पर-पर जायन्ते अकवा महोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arā ived acaramā aheva pra-pra jāyante akavā mahobhiḥ |
Translation: 5 They spring forth more and more, strong in their glories, like days, like spokes where none are last in order.

Sanskit Text: पर्श्नेः पुत्रा उपमासो रभिष्ठाः सवया मत्या मरुतः सम मिमिक्षुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛśneḥ putrā upamāso rabhiṣṭhāḥ svayā matyā marutaḥ sam mimikṣuḥ ||
Translation: Highest and mightiest are the Sons of Pṛśni. Firm to their own intention cling the Maruts.

Sanskit Text: यत परायासिष्ट पर्षतीभिर अश्वैर वीळुपविभिर मरुतो रथेभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat prāyāsiṣṭa pṛṣatībhir aśvair vīḷupavibhir maruto rathebhiḥ |
Translation: 6 When ye have hastened on with spotted coursers, O Maruts, on your cars with strong-wrought fellies,

Sanskit Text: कषोदन्त आपो रिणते वनान्य अवोस्रियो वर्षभः करन्दतु दयौः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣodanta āpo riṇate vanāny avosriyo vṛṣabhaḥ krandatu dyauḥ ||
Translation: The waters are disturbed, the woods are shattered. Let Dyaus the Red Steer send his thunder downward.

Sanskit Text: परथिष्ट यामन पर्थिवी चिद एषाम भर्तेव गर्भं सवम इच छवो धुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prathiṣṭa yāman pṛthivī cid eṣām bharteva gharbhaṃ svam ic chavo dhuḥ |
Translation: 7 Even Earth hath spread herself wide at their coming, and they as husbands have with power impregned her.

Sanskit Text: वातान हय अश्वान धुर्य रयुयुज्रे वर्षं सवेदं चक्रिरे रुद्रियासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vātān hy aśvān dhury ṛyuyujre varṣaṃ svedaṃ cakrire rudriyāsaḥ ||
Translation: They to the pole have yoked the winds for coursers: their sweat have they made rain, these Sons of Rudra.

Sanskit Text: हये नरो मरुतो मर्ळता नस तुवीमघासो अम्र्ता रतज्ञाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: haye naro maruto mṛḷatā nas tuvīmaghāso amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ |
Translation: 8 Ho! Maruts, Heroes, skilled in Law, immortal, be gracious unto us, ye rich in treasures,

Sanskit Text: सत्यश्रुतः कवयो युवानो बर्हद्गिरयो बर्हद उक्षमाणाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satyaśrutaḥ kavayo yuvāno bṛhadghirayo bṛhad ukṣamāṇāḥ ||
Translation: Ye hearers of the truth, ye sage and youthful, grown mighty, dwelling on the lofty mountains.

Sanskit Text: पर व सपळ अक्रन सुविताय दावने ऽरचा दिवे पर पर्थिव्या रतम भरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra va spaḷ akran suvitāya dāvane 'rcā dive pra pṛthivyā ṛtam bhare |
Translation: 1. YOUR spy hath called to you to give prosperity. I sing to Heaven and Earth and offer sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: उक्षन्ते अश्वान तरुषन्त आ रजो ऽनु सवम भानुं शरथयन्ते अर्णवैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukṣante aśvān taruṣanta ā rajo 'nu svam bhānuṃ śrathayante arṇavaiḥ ||
Translation: They bathe their steeds and hasten through the firmament: they spread abroad their radiance through the sea of cloud.

Sanskit Text: अमाद एषाम भियसा भूमिर एजति नौर न पूर्णा कषरति वयथिर यती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: amād eṣām bhiyasā bhūmir ejati naur na pūrṇā kṣarati vyathir yatī |
Translation: 2 Earth shakes and reels in terror at their onward rush, like a full ship which, quivering, lets the water in.

Sanskit Text: दूरेद्र्शो ये चितयन्त एमभिर अन्तर महे विदथे येतिरे नरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūredṛśo ye citayanta emabhir antar mahe vidathe yetire naraḥ ||
Translation: Marked on their ways are they, visible from afar: the Heroes press between in mighty armament.

Sanskit Text: गवाम इव शरियसे शर्ङगम उत्तमं सूर्यो न चक्षू रजसो विसर्जने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghavām iva śriyase śṛṅgham uttamaṃ sūryo na cakṣū rajaso visarjane |
Translation: 3 As the exalted horn of bulls for splendid might, as the Sun's eye set in the firmament's expanse,

Sanskit Text: अत्या इव सुभ्वश चारव सथन मर्या इव शरियसे चेतथा नरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atyā iva subhvaś cārava sthana maryā iva śriyase cetathā naraḥ ||
Translation: Like vigorous horses ye are beauteous to behold, and for your glory show like bridegrooms, O ye Men.

Sanskit Text: को वो महान्ति महताम उद अश्नवत कस काव्या मरुतः को ह पौंस्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko vo mahānti mahatām ud aśnavat kas kāvyā marutaḥ ko ha pauṃsyā |
Translation: 4 Who, O ye Maruts, may attain the mighty lore of you the mighty, who may reach your manly deeds?

Sanskit Text: यूयं ह भूमिं किरणं न रेजथ पर यद भरध्वे सुविताय दावने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyaṃ ha bhūmiṃ kiraṇaṃ na rejatha pra yad bharadhve suvitāya dāvane ||
Translation: Ye, verily, make earth tremble like a ray of light what time ye bring your boons to give prosperity,

Sanskit Text: अश्वा इवेद अरुषासः सबन्धवः शूरा इव परयुधः परोत युयुधुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvā ived aruṣāsaḥ sabandhavaḥ śūrā iva prayudhaḥ prota yuyudhuḥ |
Translation: 5 Like steeds of ruddy colour, scions of one race, as foremost champions they have battled in the van.

Sanskit Text: मर्या इव सुव्र्धो वाव्र्धुर नरः सूर्यस्य चक्षुः पर मिनन्ति वर्ष्टिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maryā iva suvṛdho vāvṛdhur naraḥ sūryasya cakṣuḥ pra minanti vṛṣṭibhiḥ ||
Translation: The Heroes have waxed strong like we.1grown manly youths; with floods of rain they make the Sun's eye fade away,

Sanskit Text: ते अज्येष्ठा अकनिष्ठास उद्भिदो ऽमध्यमासो महसा वि वाव्र्धुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te ajyeṣṭhā akaniṣṭhāsa udbhido 'madhyamāso mahasā vi vāvṛdhuḥ |
Translation: 6 Having no eldest and no youngest in their band, no middlomost, preeminent they have waxed in might,

Sanskit Text: सुजातासो जनुषा पर्श्निमातरो दिवो मर्या आ नो अछा जिगातन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sujātāso januṣā pṛśnimātaro divo maryā ā no achā jighātana ||
Translation: These Sons of Pṛśni, sprung of noble ancestry: come hitberward to us, ye bridegrooms of the sky.

Sanskit Text: वयो न ये शरेणीः पप्तुर ओजसान्तान दिवो बर्हतः सानुनस परि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayo na ye śreṇīḥ paptur ojasāntān divo bṛhataḥ sānunas pari |
Translation: 7 Like birds of air they flew with might in lengthened lines from heaven's high ridges to the borders of the sky.

Sanskit Text: अश्वास एषाम उभये यथा विदुः पर पर्वतस्य नभनूंर अचुच्यवुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvāsa eṣām ubhaye yathā viduḥ pra parvatasya nabhanūṃr acucyavuḥ ||
Translation: The steeds who carry them, as Gods and mortals know, have caused the waters of the mounuains to desGend.

Sanskit Text: मिमातु दयौर अदितिर वीतये नः सं दानुचित्रा उषसो यतन्ताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mimātu dyaur aditir vītaye naḥ saṃ dānucitrā uṣaso yatantām |
Translation: 8 May Dyaus, the Infinite, roar for our banquet: may Dawns toil for us, glittering with moisture.

Sanskit Text: आचुच्यवुर दिव्यं कोशम एत रषे रुद्रस्य मरुतो गर्णानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ācucyavur divyaṃ kośam eta ṛṣe rudrasya maruto ghṛṇānāḥ ||
Translation: Lauded by thee, these Maruts, Sons o Rudra, O Ṛṣi, have sent down the heavenly treasure.

Sanskit Text: ईळे अग्निं सववसं नमोभिर इह परसत्तो वि चयत कर्तं नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īḷe aghniṃ svavasaṃ namobhir iha prasatto vi cayat kṛtaṃ naḥ |
Translation: 1. I LAUD with reverence the gracious Agni: here may he sit and part our meed among us.

Sanskit Text: रथैर इव पर भरे वाजयद्भिः परदक्षिणिन मरुतां सतोमम रध्याम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathair iva pra bhare vājayadbhiḥ pradakṣiṇin marutāṃ stomam ṛdhyām ||
Translation: As with spoil-seeking cars I bring oblation: turned rightward I will swell the Marut's, praise-song.

Sanskit Text: आ ये तस्थुः पर्षतीषु शरुतासु सुखेषु रुद्रा मरुतो रथेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ye tasthuḥ pṛṣatīṣu śrutāsu sukheṣu rudrā maruto ratheṣu |
Translation: 2 The Maruts, yea, the Rudras, who have mounted their famous spotted deer and cars swift-moving,—

Sanskit Text: वना चिद उग्रा जिहते नि वो भिया पर्थिवी चिद रेजते पर्वतश चित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanā cid ughrā jihate ni vo bhiyā pṛthivī cid rejate parvataś cit ||
Translation: Before you, fierce Ones! woods bow down in terror: Earth, even the mountain, trembles at your coming.

Sanskit Text: पर्वतश चिन महि वर्द्धो बिभाय दिवश चित सानु रेजत सवने वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parvataś cin mahi vṛddho bibhāya divaś cit sānu rejata svane vaḥ |
Translation: 3 Though vast and tall, the mountain is affrighted, the height of heaven is shaken at your roaring

Sanskit Text: यत करीळथ मरुत रष्टिमन्त आप इव सध्र्यञ्चो धवध्वे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat krīḷatha maruta ṛṣṭimanta āpa iva sadhryañco dhavadhve ||
Translation: When, armed with lances, ye are sporting, Maruts, and rush along together like the waters.

Sanskit Text: वरा इवेद रैवतासो हिरण्यैर अभि सवधाभिस तन्वः पिपिश्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: varā ived raivatāso hiraṇyair abhi svadhābhis tanvaḥ pipiśre |
Translation: 4 They, like young suitors, sons of wealthy houses, have with their golden natures decked their bodies.

Sanskit Text: शरिये शरेयांसस तवसो रथेषु सत्रा महांसि चक्रिरे तनूषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śriye śreyāṃsas tavaso ratheṣu satrā mahāṃsi cakrire tanūṣu ||
Translation: Strong on their cars, the lordly Ones, for glory, have set their splendours on their forms for ever.

Sanskit Text: अज्येष्ठासो अकनिष्ठास एते सम भरातरो वाव्र्धुः सौभगाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajyeṣṭhāso akaniṣṭhāsa ete sam bhrātaro vāvṛdhuḥ saubhaghāya |
Translation: 5 None being eldest, none among them youngest, as brothers they have grown to happy fortune.

Sanskit Text: युवा पिता सवपा रुद्र एषां सुदुघा पर्श्निः सुदिना मरुद्भ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvā pitā svapā rudra eṣāṃ sudughā pṛśniḥ sudinā marudbhyaḥ ||
Translation: May their Sire Rudra, young and deft, and Pṛśni pouring much milk, bring fair days to the Maruts.

Sanskit Text: यद उत्तमे मरुतो मध्यमे वा यद वावमे सुभगासो दिवि षठ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad uttame maruto madhyame vā yad vāvame subhaghāso divi ṣṭha |
Translation: 6 Whether, O blessed Maruts, ye be dwelling in highest, midmost, or in lowest heaven,

Sanskit Text: अतो नो रुद्रा उत वा नव अस्याग्ने वित्ताद धविषो यद यजाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ato no rudrā uta vā nv asyāghne vittād dhaviṣo yad yajāma ||
Translation: Thence, O ye Rudras, and thou also, Agni, notice the sacrificial food we offer.

Sanskit Text: अग्निश च यन मरुतो विश्ववेदसो दिवो वहध्व उत्तराद अधि षणुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniś ca yan maruto viśvavedaso divo vahadhva uttarād adhi ṣṇubhiḥ |
Translation: 7 O Maruts, Lords of all, when Agni and when ye drive downward from sublimest heaven along the heights,

Sanskit Text: ते मन्दसाना धुनयो रिशादसो वामं धत्त यजमानाय सुन्वते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te mandasānā dhunayo riśādaso vāmaṃ dhatta yajamānāya sunvate ||
Translation: Shakers of all, rejoicing, slayers of the foe, give riches to the Soma-pressing worshipper.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने मरुद्भिः शुभयद्भिर रक्वभिः सोमम पिब मन्दसानो गणश्रिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne marudbhiḥ śubhayadbhir ṛkvabhiḥ somam piba mandasāno ghaṇaśribhiḥ |
Translation: 8 O Agni, with the Maruts as they gleam and sing, gathered in troop, rejoicing drink the Soma juice;

Sanskit Text: पावकेभिर विश्वमिन्वेभिर आयुभिर वैश्वानर परदिवा केतुना सजूः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāvakebhir viśvaminvebhir āyubhir vaiśvānara pradivā ketunā sajūḥ ||
Translation: With these the living ones who cleanse and further all, joined with thy banner, O Vaiśvānara, from of old.

Sanskit Text: के षठा नरः शरेष्ठतमा य एक-एक आयय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ke ṣṭhā naraḥ śreṣṭhatamā ya eka-eka āyaya |
Translation: 1. O HEROES lordliest of all, who are ye that have singly come

Sanskit Text: परमस्याः परावतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: paramasyāḥ parāvataḥ ||
Translation: Forth from a region most remote?

Sanskit Text: कव वो ऽशवाः कव्र्भीशवः कथं शेक कथा यय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kva vo 'śvāḥ kvṛbhīśavaḥ kathaṃ śeka kathā yaya |
Translation: 2. Where are your horses, where the reins? How came ye? how had ye the power?

Sanskit Text: पर्ष्ठे सदो नसोर यमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛṣṭhe sado nasor yamaḥ ||
Translation: Rein was on nose and seat on back.

Sanskit Text: जघने चोद एषां वि सक्थानि नरो यमुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jaghane coda eṣāṃ vi sakthāni naro yamuḥ |
Translation: 3 The whip is laid upon the flank. The heroes stretch their thighs apart,

Sanskit Text: पुत्रक्र्थे न जनयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: putrakṛthe na janayaḥ ||
Translation: Like women when the babe is born.

Sanskit Text: परा वीरास एतन मर्यासो भद्रजानयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parā vīrāsa etana maryāso bhadrajānayaḥ |
Translation: 4 Go ye, O Heroes, far away, ye bridegrooms with a lovely Spouse

Sanskit Text: अग्नितपो यथासथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnitapo yathāsatha ||
Translation: That ye may warm you at the fire.

Sanskit Text: सनत साश्व्यम पशुम उत गव्यं शतावयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanat sāśvyam paśum uta ghavyaṃ śatāvayam |
Translation: 5 May she gain cattle for her meed, hundreds of sheep and steeds and kine,

Sanskit Text: शयावाश्वस्तुताय या दोर वीरायोपबर्ब्र्हत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śyāvāśvastutāya yā dor vīrāyopabarbṛhat ||
Translation: Who threw embracing arms around the hero whom gyavaiva praised.

Sanskit Text: उत तवा सत्री शशीयसी पुंसो भवति वस्यसी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tvā strī śaśīyasī puṃso bhavati vasyasī |
Translation: 6 Yea, many a woman is more firm and better than the man who turns

Sanskit Text: अदेवत्राद अराधसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adevatrād arādhasaḥ ||
Translation: Away from Gods, andoffers not.

Sanskit Text: वि या जानाति जसुरिं वि तर्ष्यन्तं वि कामिनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yā jānāti jasuriṃ vi tṛṣyantaṃ vi kāminam |
Translation: 7 She who discerns the weak and worn, the man who thirsts and is in want

Sanskit Text: देवत्रा कर्णुते मनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devatrā kṛṇute manaḥ ||
Translation: She sets her mind upon the Gods.

Sanskit Text: उत घा नेमो अस्तुतः पुमां इति बरुवे पणिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta ghā nemo astutaḥ pumāṃ iti bruve paṇiḥ |
Translation: 8 And yet full many a one, unpraised, mean niggard, is entitled man:

Sanskit Text: स वैरदेय इत समः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vairadeya it samaḥ ||
Translation: Only in weregild is he such.

Sanskit Text: उत मे ऽरपद युवतिर ममन्दुषी परति शयावाय वर्तनिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta me 'rapad yuvatir mamanduṣī prati śyāvāya vartanim |
Translation: 9 And she, the young, the joyous-spirited, divulged the path to Śyāva, yea, to me.

Sanskit Text: वि रोहिता पुरुमीळ्हाय येमतुर विप्राय दीर्घयशसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi rohitā purumīḷhāya yematur viprāya dīrghayaśase ||
Translation: Two red steeds carried me to Purumīlha's side, that sage of far-extended fame,

Sanskit Text: यो मे धेनूनां शतं वैददश्विर यथा ददत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo me dhenūnāṃ śataṃ vaidadaśvir yathā dadat |
Translation: 10 Him who, like Vaidadasvi, like Taranta, hath bestowed on me

Sanskit Text: तरन्त इव मंहना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taranta iva maṃhanā ||
Translation: A hundred cows in liberal gift.

Sanskit Text: य ईं वहन्त आशुभिः पिबन्तो मदिरम मधु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya īṃ vahanta āśubhiḥ pibanto madiram madhu |
Translation: 11 They who are borne by rapid steeds, drinking the meath that gives delight,

Sanskit Text: अत्र शरवांसि दधिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atra śravāṃsi dadhire ||
Translation: They have attained high glories here.

Sanskit Text: येषां शरियाधि रोदसी विभ्राजन्ते रथेष्व आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yeṣāṃ śriyādhi rodasī vibhrājante ratheṣv ā |
Translation: 12 They by whose splendour both the worlds are over-spread they shine on cars

Sanskit Text: दिवि रुक्म इवोपरि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divi rukma ivopari ||
Translation: As the gold gleams above in heaven.

Sanskit Text: युवा स मारुतो गणस तवेषरथो अनेद्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvā sa māruto ghaṇas tveṣaratho anedyaḥ |
Translation: 13 That Marut band is ever young, borne on bright cars, unblamable,

Sanskit Text: शुभंयावाप्रतिष्कुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śubhaṃyāvāpratiṣkutaḥ ||
Translation: Moving to victory, checked by none.

Sanskit Text: को वेद नूनम एषां यत्रा मदन्ति धूतयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko veda nūnam eṣāṃ yatrā madanti dhūtayaḥ |
Translation: 14 Who knoweth, verily, of these where the All-shakers take delight,

Sanskit Text: रतजाता अरेपसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtajātā arepasaḥ ||
Translation: Born, spotless, after sacred Law?

Sanskit Text: यूयम मर्तं विपन्यवः परणेतार इत्था धिया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyam martaṃ vipanyavaḥ praṇetāra itthā dhiyā |
Translation: 15 Guides are ye, lovers of the song to mortal man through holy hymn,

Sanskit Text: शरोतारो यामहूतिषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrotāro yāmahūtiṣu ||
Translation: And hearers when he cries for help.

Sanskit Text: ते नो वसूनि काम्या पुरुश्चन्द्रा रिशादसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te no vasūni kāmyā puruścandrā riśādasaḥ |
Translation: 16 Do ye, destroyers of the foe, worshipful and exceeding bright,

Sanskit Text: आ यज्ञियासो वव्र्त्तन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yajñiyāso vavṛttana ||
Translation: Send down the treasures that we crave.

Sanskit Text: एतम मे सतोमम ऊर्म्ये दार्भ्याय परा वह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etam me stomam ūrmye dārbhyāya parā vaha |
Translation: 17 OUrmya, bear thou far away to Darbhya this my hymn of praise,

Sanskit Text: गिरो देवि रथीर इव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghiro devi rathīr iva ||
Translation: Songs, Goddess, as if chariot-borne.

Sanskit Text: उत मे वोचताद इति सुतसोमे रथवीतौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta me vocatād iti sutasome rathavītau |
Translation: 18 From me to Rathaviti say, when he hath pressed the Soma juice,

Sanskit Text: न कामो अप वेति मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na kāmo apa veti me ||
Translation: The wish I had departeth not.

Sanskit Text: एष कषेति रथवीतिर मघवा गोमतीर अनु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa kṣeti rathavītir maghavā ghomatīr anu |
Translation: 19 This wealthy Rathaviti dwells among the people rich in kine,

Sanskit Text: पर्वतेष्व अपश्रितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parvateṣv apaśritaḥ ||
Translation: Among the mountains, far withdrawn.

Sanskit Text: रतेन रतम अपिहितं धरुवं वां सूर्यस्य यत्र विमुचन्त्य अश्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtena ṛtam apihitaṃ dhruvaṃ vāṃ sūryasya yatra vimucanty aśvān |
Translation: 1. BY your high Law firm order is established there where they loose for travel Sūrya's horses.

Sanskit Text: दश शता सह तस्थुस तद एकं देवानां शरेष्ठं वपुषाम अपश्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśa śatā saha tasthus tad ekaṃ devānāṃ śreṣṭhaṃ vapuṣām apaśyam ||
Translation: Ten hundred stood together: there I looked on this the most marvellous Deities' one chief glory.

Sanskit Text: तत सु वाम मित्रावरुणा महित्वम ईर्मा तस्थुषीर अहभिर दुदुह्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat su vām mitrāvaruṇā mahitvam īrmā tasthuṣīr ahabhir duduhre |
Translation: 2 This, Mitra-Varuṇa, is your special greatness: floods that stood there they with the days attracted.

Sanskit Text: विश्वाः पिन्वथः सवसरस्य धेना अनु वाम एकः पविर आ ववर्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāḥ pinvathaḥ svasarasya dhenā anu vām ekaḥ pavir ā vavarta ||
Translation: Ye cause to flow all voices of the cowpen: your single chariotfelly hath rolled hither.

Sanskit Text: अधारयतम पर्थिवीम उत दयाम मित्रराजाना वरुणा महोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhārayatam pṛthivīm uta dyām mitrarājānā varuṇā mahobhiḥ |
Translation: 3 O Mitra-Varuṇa, ye by your greatness, both Kings, have firmly stablished earth and heaven,

Sanskit Text: वर्धयतम ओषधीः पिन्वतं गा अव वर्ष्टिं सर्जतं जीरदानू ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vardhayatam oṣadhīḥ pinvataṃ ghā ava vṛṣṭiṃ sṛjataṃ jīradānū ||
Translation: Ye caused the cows to stream, the plants to flourish, and, scattering swift drops, sent down the rain-flood.

Sanskit Text: आ वाम अश्वासः सुयुजो वहन्तु यतरश्मय उप यन्त्व अर्वाक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vām aśvāsaḥ suyujo vahantu yataraśmaya upa yantv arvāk |
Translation: 4 Let your well-harnessed horses bear you hither: hitherward let them come with reins drawn tightly.

Sanskit Text: घर्तस्य निर्णिग अनु वर्तते वाम उप सिन्धवः परदिवि कषरन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtasya nirṇigh anu vartate vām upa sindhavaḥ pradivi kṣaranti ||
Translation: A covering cloud of sacred oil attends you, and your streams flow to us from days aforetime.

Sanskit Text: अनु शरुताम अमतिं वर्धद उर्वीम बर्हिर इव यजुषा रक्षमाणा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu śrutām amatiṃ vardhad urvīm barhir iva yajuṣā rakṣamāṇā |
Translation: 5 To make the lustre wider and more famous, guarding the sacred grass with veneration,

Sanskit Text: नमस्वन्ता धर्तदक्षाधि गर्ते मित्रासाथे वरुणेळास्व अन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: namasvantā dhṛtadakṣādhi gharte mitrāsāthe varuṇeḷāsv antaḥ ||
Translation: Ye, Mitra-Varuṇa, firm, strong, awe-inspiring, are seated on a throne amid oblations.

Sanskit Text: अक्रविहस्ता सुक्र्ते परस्पा यं तरासाथे वरुणेळास्व अन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: akravihastā sukṛte paraspā yaṃ trāsāthe varuṇeḷāsv antaḥ |
Translation: 6 With hands that shed no blood, guarding the pious, whom, Varuni3, ye save amid oblations.

Sanskit Text: राजाना कषत्रम अह्र्णीयमाना सहस्रस्थूणम बिभ्र्थः सह दवौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājānā kṣatram ahṛṇīyamānā sahasrasthūṇam bibhṛthaḥ saha dvau ||
Translation: Ye Twain, together, Kings of willing spirit, uphold dominion based on thousand pillars.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यनिर्णिग अयो अस्य सथूणा वि भराजते दिव्य अश्वाजनीव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyanirṇigh ayo asya sthūṇā vi bhrājate divy aśvājanīva |
Translation: 7 Adorned with gold, its columns are of iron. in heaven it glitters like a whip for horses;

Sanskit Text: भद्रे कषेत्रे निमिता तिल्विले वा सनेम मध्वो अधिगर्त्यस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadre kṣetre nimitā tilvile vā sanema madhvo adhighartyasya ||
Translation: Or stablished on a field deep-spoiled and fruitful. So may we share the meath that loads your car-seat.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यरूपम उषसो वयुष्टाव अयस्थूणम उदिता सूर्यस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyarūpam uṣaso vyuṣṭāv ayasthūṇam uditā sūryasya |
Translation: 8 Ye mount your car gold-hued at break of morning, and iron-pillared when the Sun is setting,

Sanskit Text: आ रोहथो वरुण मित्र गर्तम अतश चक्षाथे अदितिं दितिं च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā rohatho varuṇa mitra ghartam ataś cakṣāthe aditiṃ ditiṃ ca ||
Translation: And from that place, O Varuṇa and Mitra, behold infinity and limit~tion.

Sanskit Text: यद बंहिष्ठं नातिविधे सुदानू अछिद्रं शर्म भुवनस्य गोपा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad baṃhiṣṭhaṃ nātividhe sudānū achidraṃ śarma bhuvanasya ghopā |
Translation: 9 Bountiful guardians of the world! the shelter that is impenetrable, strongest, flawless,

Sanskit Text: तेन नो मित्रावरुणाव अविष्टं सिषासन्तो जिगीवांसः सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tena no mitrāvaruṇāv aviṣṭaṃ siṣāsanto jighīvāṃsaḥ syāma ||
Translation: Aid us with that, O Varuṇa and Mitra, and when we long to win may we be victors.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य गोपाव अधि तिष्ठथो रथं सत्यधर्माणा परमे वयोमनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya ghopāv adhi tiṣṭhatho rathaṃ satyadharmāṇā parame vyomani |
Translation: 1. GUARDIANS of Order, ye whose Laws are ever true, in the sublimest heaven your chariot ye ascend.

Sanskit Text: यम अत्र मित्रावरुणावथो युवं तस्मै वर्ष्टिर मधुमत पिन्वते दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yam atra mitrāvaruṇāvatho yuvaṃ tasmai vṛṣṭir madhumat pinvate divaḥ ||
Translation: O Mitra-Varuṇa whomsoe’er ye: favour, here, to him the rain with sweetness streameth down from heaven.

Sanskit Text: सम्राजाव अस्य भुवनस्य राजथो मित्रावरुणा विदथे सवर्द्र्शा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samrājāv asya bhuvanasya rājatho mitrāvaruṇā vidathe svardṛśā |
Translation: 2 This world's imperial Kings, O Mitra-Varuṇa, ye rule in holy synod, looking on the light.

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्टिं वां राधो अम्र्तत्वम ईमहे दयावाप्र्थिवी वि चरन्ति तन्यवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṭiṃ vāṃ rādho amṛtatvam īmahe dyāvāpṛthivī vi caranti tanyavaḥ ||
Translation: We pray for rain, your boon, and immortality. Through heaven and over earth the thunderers take their way.

Sanskit Text: सम्राजा उग्रा वर्षभा दिवस पती पर्थिव्या मित्रावरुणा विचर्षणी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samrājā ughrā vṛṣabhā divas patī pṛthivyā mitrāvaruṇā vicarṣaṇī |
Translation: 3 Imperial Kings, strong, Heroes, Lords of earth and heaven, Mitra and Varuṇa, ye ever active Ones,

Sanskit Text: चित्रेभिर अभ्रैर उप तिष्ठथो रवं दयां वर्षयथो असुरस्य मायया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: citrebhir abhrair upa tiṣṭhatho ravaṃ dyāṃ varṣayatho asurasya māyayā ||
Translation: Ye wait on thunder with the many-tinted clouds, and by the Asura's magic power cause Heaven to rain.

Sanskit Text: माया वाम मित्रावरुणा दिवि शरिता सूर्यो जयोतिश चरति चित्रम आयुधम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: māyā vām mitrāvaruṇā divi śritā sūryo jyotiś carati citram āyudham |
Translation: 4 Your magic, Mitra-Varuṇa, resteth in the heaven. The Sun, the wondrous weapon, cometh forth as light.

Sanskit Text: तम अभ्रेण वर्ष्ट्या गूहथो दिवि पर्जन्य दरप्सा मधुमन्त ईरते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tam abhreṇa vṛṣṭyā ghūhatho divi parjanya drapsā madhumanta īrate ||
Translation: Ye hide him in the sky with cloud and flood of rain, and water-drops, Parjanya! full of sweetness flow.

Sanskit Text: रथं युञ्जते मरुतः शुभे सुखं शूरो न मित्रावरुणा गविष्टिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathaṃ yuñjate marutaḥ śubhe sukhaṃ śūro na mitrāvaruṇā ghaviṣṭiṣu |
Translation: 5 The Maruts yoke their easy car for victory, O Mitra-Varuṇa, as a hero in the wars.

Sanskit Text: रजांसि चित्रा वि चरन्ति तन्यवो दिवः सम्राजा पयसा न उक्षतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rajāṃsi citrā vi caranti tanyavo divaḥ samrājā payasā na ukṣatam ||
Translation: The thunderers roam through regions varied in their hues. Imperial Kings, bedew us with the milk of heaven.

Sanskit Text: वाचं सु मित्रावरुणाव इरावतीम पर्जन्यश चित्रां वदति तविषीमतीम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vācaṃ su mitrāvaruṇāv irāvatīm parjanyaś citrāṃ vadati tviṣīmatīm |
Translation: 6 Refreshing is your voice, O Mitra-Varuṇa: Parjanya sendeth out a wondrous mighty voice.

Sanskit Text: अभ्रा वसत मरुतः सु मायया दयां वर्षयतम अरुणाम अरेपसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhrā vasata marutaḥ su māyayā dyāṃ varṣayatam aruṇām arepasam ||
Translation: With magic power the Maruts clothe them with the clouds. Ye Two cause Heaven to rain, the red, the spotless One.

Sanskit Text: धर्मणा मित्रावरुणा विपश्चिता वरता रक्षेथे असुरस्य मायया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dharmaṇā mitrāvaruṇā vipaścitā vratā rakṣethe asurasya māyayā |
Translation: 7 Wise, with your Law and through the Asura's magic power ye guard the ordinances, Mitra-Varuṇa.

Sanskit Text: रतेन विश्वम भुवनं वि राजथः सूर्यम आ धत्थो दिवि चित्र्यं रथम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtena viśvam bhuvanaṃ vi rājathaḥ sūryam ā dhattho divi citryaṃ ratham ||
Translation: Ye by eternal Order govern all the world. Ye set the Sun in heaven as a refulgent car.

Sanskit Text: वरुणं वो रिशादसम रचा मित्रं हवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: varuṇaṃ vo riśādasam ṛcā mitraṃ havāmahe |
Translation: 1. You, foeman-slaying Varuṇa and Mitra, we invoke with song,

Sanskit Text: परि वरजेव बाह्वोर जगन्वांसा सवर्णरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari vrajeva bāhvor jaghanvāṃsā svarṇaram ||
Translation: Who, as with penfold of your arms, encompass round the realm of light.

Sanskit Text: ता बाहवा सुचेतुना पर यन्तम अस्मा अर्चते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā bāhavā sucetunā pra yantam asmā arcate |
Translation: 2 Stretch out your arms with favouring love unto this man who singeth hymns,

Sanskit Text: शेवं हि जार्यं वां विश्वासु कषासु जोगुवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śevaṃ hi jāryaṃ vāṃ viśvāsu kṣāsu joghuve ||
Translation: For in all places is sung forth your evergracious friendliness.

Sanskit Text: यन नूनम अश्यां गतिम मित्रस्य यायाम पथा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yan nūnam aśyāṃ ghatim mitrasya yāyām pathā |
Translation: 3 That I may gain a refuge now, may my steps be on Mitra's path.

Sanskit Text: अस्य परियस्य शर्मण्य अहिंसानस्य सश्चिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya priyasya śarmaṇy ahiṃsānasya saścire ||
Translation: Men go protected in the charge of this dear Friend who harms us not.

Sanskit Text: युवाभ्याम मित्रावरुणोपमं धेयाम रचा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvābhyām mitrāvaruṇopamaṃ dheyām ṛcā |
Translation: 4 Mitra and Varuṇa, from you may I, by song, win noblest meed.

Sanskit Text: यद ध कषये मघोनां सतोत्णां च सपूर्धसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad dha kṣaye maghonāṃ stotṇāṃ ca spūrdhase ||
Translation: That shall stir envy in the homes of wealthy chiefs and those who praise.

Sanskit Text: आ नो मित्र सुदीतिभिर वरुणश च सधस्थ आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no mitra sudītibhir varuṇaś ca sadhastha ā |
Translation: 5 With your fair splendours, Varuṇa and Mitra, to our gathering come,

Sanskit Text: सवे कषये मघोनां सखीनां च वर्धसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sve kṣaye maghonāṃ sakhīnāṃ ca vṛdhase ||
Translation: That in their homes the wealthy chiefs and they who are your friends may thrive.

Sanskit Text: युवं नो येषु वरुण कषत्रम बर्हच च बिभ्र्थः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ no yeṣu varuṇa kṣatram bṛhac ca bibhṛthaḥ |
Translation: 6 With those, moreover, among whom ye hold your high supremacy,

Sanskit Text: उरु णो वाजसातये कर्तं राये सवस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uru ṇo vājasātaye kṛtaṃ rāye svastaye ||
Translation: Vouchsafe us room that we may win strength for prosperity and wealth.

Sanskit Text: उछन्त्याम मे यजता देवक्षत्रे रुशद्गवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uchantyām me yajatā devakṣatre ruśadghavi |
Translation: 7 When morning flushes, Holy Ones! in the Gods’ realm where white Cows shine,

Sanskit Text: सुतं सोमं न हस्तिभिर आ पड्भिर धावतं नरा बिभ्रताव अर्चनानसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sutaṃ somaṃ na hastibhir ā paḍbhir dhāvataṃ narā bibhratāv arcanānasam ||
Translation: Supporting Arcananas, speed, ye Heroes, with your active feet hither to my pressed Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: यश चिकेत स सुक्रतुर देवत्रा स बरवीतु नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaś ciketa sa sukratur devatrā sa bravītu naḥ |
Translation: 1. FULL wise is he who hath discerned: let him speak to us of the Gods,—

Sanskit Text: वरुणो यस्य दर्शतो मित्रो वा वनते गिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: varuṇo yasya darśato mitro vā vanate ghiraḥ ||
Translation: The man whose praise-songs Varuṇa the beautiful, or Mitra, loves.

Sanskit Text: ता हि शरेष्ठवर्चसा राजाना दीर्घश्रुत्तमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā hi śreṣṭhavarcasā rājānā dīrghaśruttamā |
Translation: 2 For they are Kings of noblest might, of glorious fame most widely spread;

Sanskit Text: ता सत्पती रताव्र्ध रतावाना जने-जने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā satpatī ṛtāvṛdha ṛtāvānā jane-jane ||
Translation: Lords of the brave, who strengthen Law, the Holy Ones with every race.

Sanskit Text: ता वाम इयानो ऽवसे पूर्वा उप बरुवे सचा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā vām iyāno 'vase pūrvā upa bruve sacā |
Translation: 3 Approaching you with prayer for aid, together I address you first

Sanskit Text: सवश्वासः सु चेतुना वाजां अभि पर दावने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svaśvāsaḥ su cetunā vājāṃ abhi pra dāvane ||
Translation: We who have good steeds call on you, Most Sage, to give us strength besides.

Sanskit Text: मित्रो अंहोश चिद आद उरु कषयाय गातुं वनते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitro aṃhoś cid ād uru kṣayāya ghātuṃ vanate |
Translation: 4 E’en out of misery Mitra gives a way to dwelling at our case,

Sanskit Text: मित्रस्य हि परतूर्वतः सुमतिर अस्ति विधतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitrasya hi pratūrvataḥ sumatir asti vidhataḥ ||
Translation: For he who worships hath the grace of Mitra, fighter in the van. '

Sanskit Text: वयम मित्रस्यावसि सयाम सप्रथस्तमे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayam mitrasyāvasi syāma saprathastame |
Translation: 5 In Mitra's shelter that extends to utmost distance may we dwell,

Sanskit Text: अनेहसस तवोतयः सत्रा वरुणशेषसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anehasas tvotayaḥ satrā varuṇaśeṣasaḥ ||
Translation: Unmenaced, guarded by the care, ever as sons of Varuṇa.

Sanskit Text: युवम मित्रेमं जनं यतथः सं च नयथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvam mitremaṃ janaṃ yatathaḥ saṃ ca nayathaḥ |
Translation: 6 Ye, Mitra, urge this people on, and to one end direct their ways.

Sanskit Text: मा मघोनः परि खयतम मो अस्माकम रषीणां गोपीथे न उरुष्यतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā maghonaḥ pari khyatam mo asmākam ṛṣīṇāṃ ghopīthe na uruṣyatam ||
Translation: Neglect not ye the wealthy chiefs, neglect not us the Ṛṣis: be our guardians when ye quaff the milk.

Sanskit Text: आ चिकितान सुक्रतू देवौ मर्त रिशादसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā cikitāna sukratū devau marta riśādasā |
Translation: 1. O SAPIENT man, call the Two Gods, the very wise, who slay the foe.

Sanskit Text: वरुणाय रतपेशसे दधीत परयसे महे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: varuṇāya ṛtapeśase dadhīta prayase mahe ||
Translation: For Varuṇa, whose form is Law, place offerings for his great delight.

Sanskit Text: ता हि कषत्रम अविह्रुतं सम्यग असुर्यम आशाते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā hi kṣatram avihrutaṃ samyagh asuryam āśāte |
Translation: 2 For they have won unbroken sway in full perfection, power divine.

Sanskit Text: अध वरतेव मानुषं सवर ण धायि दर्शतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha vrateva mānuṣaṃ svar ṇa dhāyi darśatam ||
Translation: And, like high laws, the world of man hath been made beautiful as light.

Sanskit Text: ता वाम एषे रथानाम उर्वीं गव्यूतिम एषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā vām eṣe rathānām urvīṃ ghavyūtim eṣām |
Translation: 3 Therefore we praise you that your cars may travel far in front of ours-

Sanskit Text: रातहव्यस्य सुष्टुतिं दध्र्क सतोमैर मनामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rātahavyasya suṣṭutiṃ dadhṛk stomair manāmahe ||
Translation: You who accept the eulogy of Ratahavya with his hymns.

Sanskit Text: अधा हि काव्या युवं दक्षस्य पूर्भिर अद्भुता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā hi kāvyā yuvaṃ dakṣasya pūrbhir adbhutā |
Translation: 4 And ye show wMom, Wondrous Gods with fulness of intellIgence.

Sanskit Text: नि केतुना जनानां चिकेथे पूतदक्षसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni ketunā janānāṃ cikethe pūtadakṣasā ||
Translation: By men's discernment are Ve marked, O ye whose might is purified.

Sanskit Text: तद रतम पर्थिवि बर्हच छरवेष रषीणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad ṛtam pṛthivi bṛhac chravaeṣa ṛṣīṇām |
Translation: 5 This is the Law sublime, O Earth: to aid the Ṛṣis’ toil for fame

Sanskit Text: जरयसानाव अरम पर्थ्व अति कषरन्ति यामभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jrayasānāv aram pṛthv ati kṣaranti yāmabhiḥ ||
Translation: The Two, wide-spreading, are prepared. They come with ample overflow.

Sanskit Text: आ यद वाम ईयचक्षसा मित्र वयं च सूरयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yad vām īyacakṣasā mitra vayaṃ ca sūrayaḥ |
Translation: 6 Mitra, ye Gods with wandering eyes, would that the worshippers and we

Sanskit Text: वयचिष्ठे बहुपाय्ये यतेमहि सवराज्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyaciṣṭhe bahupāyye yatemahi svarājye ||
Translation: Might strive to reach the realm ye rule, most spacious and protected well,

Sanskit Text: बळ इत्था देव निष्क्र्तम आदित्या यजतम बर्हत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: baḷ itthā deva niṣkṛtam ādityā yajatam bṛhat |
Translation: 1. YE Gods, Ādityas, Varuṇa, Aryaman, Mitra, verily

Sanskit Text: वरुण मित्रार्यमन वर्षिष्ठं कषत्रम आशाथे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: varuṇa mitrāryaman varṣiṣṭhaṃ kṣatram āśāthe ||
Translation: Have here obtained supremest sway, high, holy, set apart for you.

Sanskit Text: आ यद योनिं हिरण्ययं वरुण मित्र सदथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yad yoniṃ hiraṇyayaṃ varuṇa mitra sadathaḥ |
Translation: 2 When, Varuṇa and Mitra, ye sit in your golden dwelling-place,

Sanskit Text: धर्तारा चर्षणीनां यन्तं सुम्नं रिशादसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhartārā carṣaṇīnāṃ yantaṃ sumnaṃ riśādasā ||
Translation: Ye Twain, supporters of mankind, foeslayers, give felicity.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे हि विश्ववेदसो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve hi viśvavedaso varuṇo mitro aryamā |
Translation: 3 All these, possessors of all wealth, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman,

Sanskit Text: वरता पदेव सश्चिरे पान्ति मर्त्यं रिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vratā padeva saścire pānti martyaṃ riṣaḥ ||
Translation: Follow their ways, as if with feet, and guard from injury mortal man.

Sanskit Text: ते हि सत्या रतस्प्र्श रतावानो जने-जने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te hi satyā ṛtaspṛśa ṛtāvāno jane-jane |
Translation: 4 For they are true, they cleave to Law, held holy among every race,

Sanskit Text: सुनीथासः सुदानवो ऽंहोश चिद उरुचक्रयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sunīthāsaḥ sudānavo 'ṃhoś cid urucakrayaḥ ||
Translation: Good leaders, bounteous in their gifts, deliverers even from distress.

Sanskit Text: को नु वाम मित्रास्तुतो वरुणो वा तनूनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko nu vām mitrāstuto varuṇo vā tanūnām |
Translation: 5 Which of your persons, Varuṇa or Mitra, merits not our praise?

Sanskit Text: तत सु वाम एषते मतिर अत्रिभ्य एषते मतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat su vām eṣate matir atribhya eṣate matiḥ ||
Translation: Therefore our thought is turned to you, the Atris' thought is turned to you.

Sanskit Text: पर वो मित्राय गायत वरुणाय विपा गिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vo mitrāya ghāyata varuṇāya vipā ghirā |
Translation: 1. SING forth unto your Varuṇa and Mitra with a song inspired.

Sanskit Text: महिक्षत्राव रतम बर्हत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahikṣatrāv ṛtam bṛhat ||
Translation: They, Mighty Lords, are lofty Law

Sanskit Text: सम्राजा या घर्तयोनी मित्रश चोभा वरुणश च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samrājā yā ghṛtayonī mitraś cobhā varuṇaś ca |
Translation: 2 Full springs of fatness, Sovran Kings, Mitra. and Varuṇa, the Twain,

Sanskit Text: देवा देवेषु परशस्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devā deveṣu praśastā ||
Translation: Gods glorified among the Gods.

Sanskit Text: ता नः शक्तम पार्थिवस्य महो रायो दिव्यस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā naḥ śaktam pārthivasya maho rāyo divyasya |
Translation: 3 So help ye us to riches, great terrestrial and celestial wealth:

Sanskit Text: महि वां कषत्रं देवेषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahi vāṃ kṣatraṃ deveṣu ||
Translation: Vast is your sway among the Gods.

Sanskit Text: रतम रतेन सपन्तेषिरं दक्षम आशाते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtam ṛtena sapanteṣiraṃ dakṣam āśāte |
Translation: 4 Carefully tending Law with Law they have attained their vigorous might.

Sanskit Text: अद्रुहा देवौ वर्धेते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adruhā devau vardhete ||
Translation: The two Gods wax devoid of guile.

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्टिद्यावा रीत्य्र्पेषस पती दानुमत्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṭidyāvā rītyṛpeṣas patī dānumatyāḥ |
Translation: 5 With rainy skies and streaming floods, Lords of the strength that bringeth gifts,

Sanskit Text: बर्हन्तं गर्तम आशाते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhantaṃ ghartam āśāte ||
Translation: A lofty seat have they attained.

Sanskit Text: तरी रोचना वरुण तरींर उत दयून तरीणि मित्र धारयथो रजांसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trī rocanā varuṇa trīṃr uta dyūn trīṇi mitra dhārayatho rajāṃsi |
Translation: 1. THREE spheres of light, O Varuṇa, three heavens, three firmaments ye comprehend, O Mitra:

Sanskit Text: वाव्र्धानाव अमतिं कषत्रियस्यानु वरतं रक्षमाणाव अजुर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāvṛdhānāv amatiṃ kṣatriyasyānu vrataṃ rakṣamāṇāv ajuryam ||
Translation: Waxed strong, ye keep the splendour of dominion, guarding the Ordinance that lasts for ever.

Sanskit Text: इरावतीर वरुण धेनवो वाम मधुमद वां सिन्धवो मित्र दुह्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: irāvatīr varuṇa dhenavo vām madhumad vāṃ sindhavo mitra duhre |
Translation: 2 Ye, Varuṇa, have kine who yield refreshment; Mitra, your floods pour water full of sweetness.

Sanskit Text: तरयस तस्थुर वर्षभासस तिस्र्णां धिषणानां रेतोधा वि दयुमन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trayas tasthur vṛṣabhāsas tisṛṇāṃ dhiṣaṇānāṃ retodhā vi dyumantaḥ ||
Translation: There stand the Three Steers, splendid in their brightness, who fill the three world-bowls with genial moisture.

Sanskit Text: परातर देवीम अदितिं जोहवीमि मध्यंदिन उदिता सूर्यस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātar devīm aditiṃ johavīmi madhyaṃdina uditā sūryasya |
Translation: 3 I call at dawn on Aditi the Goddess, I call at noon and when the Sun is setting.

Sanskit Text: राये मित्रावरुणा सर्वतातेळे तोकाय तनयाय शं योः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāye mitrāvaruṇā sarvatāteḷe tokāya tanayāya śaṃ yoḥ ||
Translation: I pray, O Mitra-Varuṇa, for safety, for wealth and progeny, in rest and trouble.

Sanskit Text: या धर्तारा रजसो रोचनस्योतादित्या दिव्या पार्थिवस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā dhartārā rajaso rocanasyotādityā divyā pārthivasya |
Translation: 4 Ye who uphold the region, sphere of brightness, ye who support earth's realm Divine Ādityas,

Sanskit Text: न वां देवा अम्र्ता आ मिनन्ति वरतानि मित्रावरुणा धरुवाणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na vāṃ devā amṛtā ā minanti vratāni mitrāvaruṇā dhruvāṇi ||
Translation: The Immortal Gods, O Varuṇa and Mitra, never impair your everlasting statutes.

Sanskit Text: पुरूरुणा चिद धय अस्त्य अवो नूनं वां वरुण |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purūruṇā cid dhy asty avo nūnaṃ vāṃ varuṇa |
Translation: 1. EVEN far and wide, O Varuṇa and Mitra, doth your grace extend.

Sanskit Text: मित्र वंसि वां सुमतिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitra vaṃsi vāṃ sumatim ||
Translation: May I obtain your kind good-will.

Sanskit Text: ता वां सम्यग अद्रुह्वाणेषम अश्याम धायसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā vāṃ samyagh adruhvāṇeṣam aśyāma dhāyase |
Translation: 2 From you, benignant Gods, may we gain fully food for sustenance.

Sanskit Text: वयं ते रुद्रा सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ te rudrā syāma ||
Translation: Such, O ye Rudras, my we be.

Sanskit Text: पातं नो रुद्रा पायुभिर उत तरायेथां सुत्रात्रा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pātaṃ no rudrā pāyubhir uta trāyethāṃ sutrātrā |
Translation: 3 Guard us, O Rudras. with your guar4 save us, ye skilled to save, my we

Sanskit Text: तुर्याम दस्यून तनूभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: turyāma dasyūn tanūbhiḥ ||
Translation: Subdue the Dasyus, we ourselves,

Sanskit Text: मा कस्याद्भुतक्रतू यक्षम भुजेमा तनूभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā kasyādbhutakratū yakṣam bhujemā tanūbhiḥ |
Translation: 4 Or ne’er may we, O Wondrous Strong, enjoy another's solemn feast,

Sanskit Text: मा शेषसा मा तनसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā śeṣasā mā tanasā ||
Translation: Ourselves, our sons, or progeny.

Sanskit Text: यद अद्य सथः परावति यद अर्वावत्य अश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad adya sthaḥ parāvati yad arvāvaty aśvinā |
Translation: 1. WHETHER, O Aśvins, ye this day be far remote or near at hand,

Sanskit Text: यद वा पुरू पुरुभुजा यद अन्तरिक्ष आ गतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā purū purubhujā yad antarikṣa ā ghatam ||
Translation: In many spots or in mid-air, come hither, Lords of ample wealth.

Sanskit Text: इह तया पुरुभूतमा पुरू दंसांसि बिभ्रता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iha tyā purubhūtamā purū daṃsāṃsi bibhratā |
Translation: 2 These here, who show o’er widest space, bringing full many a wondrous act,

Sanskit Text: वरस्या याम्य अध्रिगू हुवे तुविष्टमा भुजे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: varasyā yāmy adhrighū huve tuviṣṭamā bhuje ||
Translation: Resistless, lovingly I seek, I call the Mightiest to enjoy.

Sanskit Text: ईर्मान्यद वपुषे वपुश चक्रं रथस्य येमथुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īrmānyad vapuṣe vapuś cakraṃ rathasya yemathuḥ |
Translation: 3 Another beauteous wheel have ye fixed there to decorate your car.

Sanskit Text: पर्य अन्या नाहुषा युगा मह्ना रजांसि दीयथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pary anyā nāhuṣā yughā mahnā rajāṃsi dīyathaḥ ||
Translation: With others through the realms ye roam in might unto the neighbouring tribes.

Sanskit Text: तद ऊ षु वाम एना कर्तं विश्वा यद वाम अनु षटवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad ū ṣu vām enā kṛtaṃ viśvā yad vām anu ṣṭave |
Translation: 4 That deed of yours that is extolled, Visvas! hath all been done with this.

Sanskit Text: नाना जाताव अरेपसा सम अस्मे बन्धुम एयथुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nānā jātāv arepasā sam asme bandhum eyathuḥ ||
Translation: Born otherwise, and spotless, ye have entered kinship's bonds with us.

Sanskit Text: आ यद वां सूर्या रथं तिष्ठद रघुष्यदं सदा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yad vāṃ sūryā rathaṃ tiṣṭhad raghuṣyadaṃ sadā |
Translation: 5 When Sūrya mounted on your car that rolls for ever rapidly,

Sanskit Text: परि वाम अरुषा वयो घर्णा वरन्त आतपः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari vām aruṣā vayo ghṛṇā varanta ātapaḥ ||
Translation: Birds of red hue were round about and burning splendours compassed you.

Sanskit Text: युवोर अत्रिश चिकेतति नरा सुम्नेन चेतसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvor atriś ciketati narā sumnena cetasā |
Translation: 6 Atri bethinks himself of you, O Heroes, with a friendly mind,

Sanskit Text: घर्मं यद वाम अरेपसं नासत्यास्ना भुरण्यति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: gharmaṃ yad vām arepasaṃ nāsatyāsnā bhuraṇyati ||
Translation: What time, Nāsatyas, with his mouth he stirs the spotless flame for you.

Sanskit Text: उग्रो वां ककुहो ययिः शर्ण्वे यामेषु संतनिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughro vāṃ kakuho yayiḥ śṛṇve yāmeṣu saṃtaniḥ |
Translation: 7 Strong is your swiftly moving steed, famed his exertion in the course

Sanskit Text: यद वां दंसोभिर अश्विनात्रिर नराववर्तति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vāṃ daṃsobhir aśvinātrir narāvavartati ||
Translation: When by your great deeds, Aśvins, Chiefs, Atri is brought to us again.

Sanskit Text: मध्व ऊ षु मधूयुवा रुद्रा सिषक्ति पिप्युषी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhva ū ṣu madhūyuvā rudrā siṣakti pipyuṣī |
Translation: 8 Lovers of sweetness, Rudras, she who streams with sweetness waits on you.

Sanskit Text: यत समुद्राति पर्षथः पक्वाः पर्क्षो भरन्त वाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat samudrāti parṣathaḥ pakvāḥ pṛkṣo bharanta vām ||
Translation: When ye have travelled through the seas men bring you gifts of well-dressed food.

Sanskit Text: सत्यम इद वा उ अश्विना युवाम आहुर मयोभुवा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satyam id vā u aśvinā yuvām āhur mayobhuvā |
Translation: 9 Aśvins, with truth they call you Twain bestowers of felicity;

Sanskit Text: ता यामन यामहूतमा यामन्न आ मर्ळयत्तमा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā yāman yāmahūtamā yāmann ā mṛḷayattamā ||
Translation: At sacrifice most prompt to hear, most gracious ye at sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: इमा बरह्माणि वर्धनाश्विभ्यां सन्तु शंतमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā brahmāṇi vardhanāśvibhyāṃ santu śaṃtamā |
Translation: 10 Most pleasing to the Aśvins be these prayers which magnify their might,

Sanskit Text: या तक्षाम रथां इवावोचाम बर्हन नमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā takṣāma rathāṃ ivāvocāma bṛhan namaḥ ||
Translation: Which we have fashioned, even as cars high reverence have we spoken forth.

Sanskit Text: कूष्ठो देवाव अश्विनाद्या दिवो मनावसू |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kūṣṭho devāv aśvinādyā divo manāvasū |
Translation: 1. WHERE in the heavens are ye to-day, Gods, Aśvins, rich in constancy?

Sanskit Text: तच छरवथो वर्षण्वसू अत्रिर वाम आ विवासति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tac chravatho vṛṣaṇvasū atrir vām ā vivāsati ||
Translation: Hear this, ye excellent as Steers: Atri inviteth you to come.

Sanskit Text: कुह तया कुह नु शरुता दिवि देवा नासत्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kuha tyā kuha nu śrutā divi devā nāsatyā |
Translation: 2 Where are they now? Where are the Twain, the famed Nāsatyas, Gods in heaven?

Sanskit Text: कस्मिन्न आ यतथो जने को वां नदीनां सचा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kasminn ā yatatho jane ko vāṃ nadīnāṃ sacā ||
Translation: Who is the man ye strive to reach? Who of your suppliants is with you?

Sanskit Text: कं याथः कं ह गछथः कम अछा युञ्जाथे रथम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaṃ yāthaḥ kaṃ ha ghachathaḥ kam achā yuñjāthe ratham |
Translation: 3 Whom do ye visit, whom approach? to whom direct your harnessed car?

Sanskit Text: कस्य बरह्माणि रण्यथो वयं वाम उश्मसीष्टये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kasya brahmāṇi raṇyatho vayaṃ vām uśmasīṣṭaye ||
Translation: With whose devotions are ye pleased? We long for you to further us.

Sanskit Text: पौरं चिद धय उदप्रुतम पौर पौराय जिन्वथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pauraṃ cid dhy udaprutam paura paurāya jinvathaḥ |
Translation: 4 Ye, Strengtheners, for Paura stir the filler swimming in the flood,

Sanskit Text: यद ईं गर्भीततातये सिंहम इव दरुहस पदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad īṃ ghṛbhītatātaye siṃham iva druhas pade ||
Translation: Advancing to be captured like a lion to the ambuscade.

Sanskit Text: पर चयवानाज जुजुरुषो वव्रिम अत्कं न मुञ्चथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra cyavānāj jujuruṣo vavrim atkaṃ na muñcathaḥ |
Translation: 5 Ye from cyavana worn with age removed his skin as ’twere a robe.

Sanskit Text: युवा यदी कर्थः पुनर आ कामम रण्वे वध्वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvā yadī kṛthaḥ punar ā kāmam ṛṇve vadhvaḥ ||
Translation: So, when ye made him young again, he stirred the longing of a dame.

Sanskit Text: अस्ति हि वाम इह सतोता समसि वां संद्र्शि शरिये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asti hi vām iha stotā smasi vāṃ saṃdṛśi śriye |
Translation: 6 Here is the man who lauds you both: to see your glory are we here.

Sanskit Text: नू शरुतम म आ गतम अवोभिर वाजिनीवसू ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū śrutam ma ā ghatam avobhir vājinīvasū ||
Translation: Now bear me, come with saving help, ye who are rich in store of wealth.

Sanskit Text: को वाम अद्य पुरूणाम आ वव्ने मर्त्यानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko vām adya purūṇām ā vavne martyānām |
Translation: 7 Who among many mortal men this day hath won you to himself?

Sanskit Text: को विप्रो विप्रवाहसा को यज्ञैर वाजिनीवसू ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko vipro vipravāhasā ko yajñair vājinīvasū ||
Translation: What bard, accepters of the bard? Who, rich in wealth! with sacrifice?

Sanskit Text: आ वां रथो रथानां येष्ठो यात्व अश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ ratho rathānāṃ yeṣṭho yātv aśvinā |
Translation: 8 O Aśvins, may your car approach, most excellent of cars for speed.

Sanskit Text: पुरू चिद अस्मयुस तिर आङगूषो मर्त्येष्व आ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purū cid asmayus tira āṅghūṣo martyeṣv ā ||
Translation: Through many regions may our praise pass onward among mortal men.

Sanskit Text: शम ऊ षु वाम मधूयुवास्माकम अस्तु चर्क्र्तिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śam ū ṣu vām madhūyuvāsmākam astu carkṛtiḥ |
Translation: 9 May our laudation of you Twain, lovers of meath! be sweet to you.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाचीना विचेतसा विभिः शयेनेव दीयतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvācīnā vicetasā vibhiḥ śyeneva dīyatam ||
Translation: Fly hitherward, ye wise of heart, like falcons with your winged steeds.

Sanskit Text: अश्विना यद ध कर्हि चिच छुश्रूयातम इमं हवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvinā yad dha karhi cic chuśrūyātam imaṃ havam |
Translation: 10 O Aśvins, when at any time ye listen to this call of mine,

Sanskit Text: वस्वीर ऊ षु वाम भुजः पर्ञ्चन्ति सु वाम पर्चः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasvīr ū ṣu vām bhujaḥ pṛñcanti su vām pṛcaḥ ||
Translation: For you is dainty food prepared: they mix refreshing food for you.

Sanskit Text: परति परियतमं रथं वर्षणं वसुवाहनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati priyatamaṃ rathaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vasuvāhanam |
Translation: 1. To meet your treasure-bringing car, the mighty car most dear to us,

Sanskit Text: सतोता वाम अश्विनाव रषि सतोमेन परति भूषति माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stotā vām aśvināv ṛṣi stomena prati bhūṣati mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam ||
Translation: Aśvins, the Ṛṣi is prepared, your raiser, with his song of praise. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

Sanskit Text: अत्यायातम अश्विना तिरो विश्वा अहं सना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atyāyātam aśvinā tiro viśvā ahaṃ sanā |
Translation: 2 Pass, O ye Aśvins, pass away beyond all tribes of selfish men,

Sanskit Text: दस्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी सुषुम्ना सिन्धुवाहसा माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dasrā hiraṇyavartanī suṣumnā sindhuvāhasā mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam ||
Translation: Wonderful, with your golden paths, most gracious, bringers of the flood. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

Sanskit Text: आ नो रत्नानि बिभ्रताव अश्विना गछतं युवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no ratnāni bibhratāv aśvinā ghachataṃ yuvam |
Translation: 3 Come to us, O ye Aśvin Pair, bringing your precious treasures, come

Sanskit Text: रुद्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी जुषाणा वाजिनीवसू माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rudrā hiraṇyavartanī juṣāṇā vājinīvasū mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam ||
Translation: Ye Rudras, on your paths of gold, rejoicing, rich in store of wealth. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

Sanskit Text: सुष्टुभो वां वर्षण्वसू रथे वाणीच्य आहिता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suṣṭubho vāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū rathe vāṇīcy āhitā |
Translation: 4 O strong and Good, the voice of him who lauds you well cleaves to your car.

Sanskit Text: उत वां ककुहो मर्गः पर्क्षः कर्णोति वापुषो माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta vāṃ kakuho mṛghaḥ pṛkṣaḥ kṛṇoti vāpuṣo mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam ||
Translation: And that great beast, your chariot-steed, fair, wonderful, makes dainty food. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

Sanskit Text: बोधिन्मनसा रथ्येषिरा हवनश्रुता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bodhinmanasā rathyeṣirā havanaśrutā |
Translation: 5 Watchful in spirit, born on cars, impetuous, listing to his cry,

Sanskit Text: विभिश चयवानम अश्विना नि याथो अद्वयाविनम माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vibhiś cyavānam aśvinā ni yātho advayāvinam mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam ||
Translation: Aśvins, with winged steeds ye speed down to cyavana void of guile. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

Sanskit Text: आ वां नरा मनोयुजो ऽशवासः परुषितप्सवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ narā manoyujo 'śvāsaḥ pruṣitapsavaḥ |
Translation: 6 Hither, O Heroes, let your steeds, of dappled hue, yoked at the thought,

Sanskit Text: वयो वहन्तु पीतये सह सुम्नेभिर अश्विना माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayo vahantu pītaye saha sumnebhir aśvinā mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam ||
Translation: Your flying steeds, O Aśvins, bring you hitherward, with bliss, to drink. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

Sanskit Text: अश्विनाव एह गछतं नासत्या मा वि वेनतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvināv eha ghachataṃ nāsatyā mā vi venatam |
Translation: 7 O Aśvins, hither come to us; Nāsatyas, be not disinclined.

Sanskit Text: तिरश चिद अर्यया परि वर्तिर यातम अदाभ्या माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tiraś cid aryayā pari vartir yātam adābhyā mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam ||
Translation: Through longing for the pious turn out of the way to reach our home. Lovers of sweetness, bear my call.

Sanskit Text: अस्मिन यज्ञे अदाभ्या जरितारं शुभस पती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmin yajñe adābhyā jaritāraṃ śubhas patī |
Translation: 8 Ye Lords of Splendour, free from guile, come, stand at this our sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: अवस्युम अश्विना युवं गर्णन्तम उप भूषथो माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avasyum aśvinā yuvaṃ ghṛṇantam upa bhūṣatho mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam ||
Translation: Beside the singer, Aśvins, who longs for your grace and lauds you both. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

Sanskit Text: अभूद उषा रुशत्पशुर आग्निर अधाय्य रत्वियः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhūd uṣā ruśatpaśur āghnir adhāyy ṛtviyaḥ |
Translation: 9 Dawn with her white herd hath appeared, and in due time hath fire been placed.

Sanskit Text: अयोजि वां वर्षण्वसू रथो दस्राव अमर्त्यो माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayoji vāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū ratho dasrāv amartyo mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam ||
Translation: Harnessed is your immortal car, O WonderWorkers, strong and kind. Lovers of sweetness, bear my call.

Sanskit Text: आ भात्य अग्निर उषसाम अनीकम उद विप्राणां देवया वाचो अस्थुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā bhāty aghnir uṣasām anīkam ud viprāṇāṃ devayā vāco asthuḥ |
Translation: 1. AGNI, the bright face of the Dawns, is shining; the singers' pious voices have ascended.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाञ्चा नूनं रथ्येह यातम पीपिवांसम अश्विना घर्मम अछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāñcā nūnaṃ rathyeha yātam pīpivāṃsam aśvinā gharmam acha ||
Translation: Borne on your chariot, Aśvins, turn you hither and come unto our full and rich libation.

Sanskit Text: न संस्क्र्तम पर मिमीतो गमिष्ठान्ति नूनम अश्विनोपस्तुतेह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na saṃskṛtam pra mimīto ghamiṣṭhānti nūnam aśvinopastuteha |
Translation: 2 Most frequent guests, they scorn not what is ready: even now the lauded Aśvins are beside us.

Sanskit Text: दिवाभिपित्वे ऽवसागमिष्ठा परत्य अवर्तिं दाशुषे शम्भविष्ठा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divābhipitve 'vasāghamiṣṭhā praty avartiṃ dāśuṣe śambhaviṣṭhā ||
Translation: With promptest aid they come at morn and evening, the worshipper's most blessed guards from trouble.

Sanskit Text: उता यातं संगवे परातर अह्नो मध्यंदिन उदिता सूर्यस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: utā yātaṃ saṃghave prātar ahno madhyaṃdina uditā sūryasya |
Translation: 3 Yea, come at milking-time, at early morning, at noon of day and when the Sun is setting,

Sanskit Text: दिवा नक्तम अवसा शंतमेन नेदानीम पीतिर अश्विना ततान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divā naktam avasā śaṃtamena nedānīm pītir aśvinā tatāna ||
Translation: By day, by night, with favour most auspicious. Not only now the draught hath drawn the Aśvins.

Sanskit Text: इदं हि वाम परदिवि सथानम ओक इमे गर्हा अश्विनेदं दुरोणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ hi vām pradivi sthānam oka ime ghṛhā aśvinedaṃ duroṇam |
Translation: 4 For this place, Aśvins, was of old your dwelling, these were your houses, this your habitation.

Sanskit Text: आ नो दिवो बर्हतः पर्वताद आद्भ्यो यातम इषम ऊर्जं वहन्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no divo bṛhataḥ parvatād ādbhyo yātam iṣam ūrjaṃ vahantā ||
Translation: Come to us from high heaven and from the mountain. Come from the waters bringing food and vigour.

Sanskit Text: सम अश्विनोर अवसा नूतनेन मयोभुवा सुप्रणीती गमेम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī ghamema |
Translation: 5 May we obtain the Aśvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy guidance.

Sanskit Text: आ नो रयिं वहतम ओत वीरान आ विश्वान्य अम्र्ता सौभगानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no rayiṃ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhaghāni ||
Translation: Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!

Sanskit Text: परातर्यावाणा परथमा यजध्वम पुरा गर्ध्राद अररुषः पिबातः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātaryāvāṇā prathamā yajadhvam purā ghṛdhrād araruṣaḥ pibātaḥ |
Translation: 1. FIRST worship those who come at early morning: let the Twain drink before the giftless niggard.

Sanskit Text: परातर हि यज्ञम अश्विना दधाते पर शंसन्ति कवयः पूर्वभाजः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātar hi yajñam aśvinā dadhāte pra śaṃsanti kavayaḥ pūrvabhājaḥ ||
Translation: The Aśvins claim the sacrifice at daybreak: the sages yielding the first share extol them.

Sanskit Text: परातर यजध्वम अश्विना हिनोत न सायम अस्ति देवया अजुष्टम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātar yajadhvam aśvinā hinota na sāyam asti devayā ajuṣṭam |
Translation: 2 Worship at dawn and instigate the Aśvins: nor is the worshipper at eve rejected.

Sanskit Text: उतान्यो अस्मद यजते वि चावः पूर्वः-पूर्वो यजमानो वनीयान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utānyo asmad yajate vi cāvaḥ pūrvaḥ-pūrvo yajamāno vanīyān ||
Translation: Besides ourselves another craves and worships: each first in worship is most highly favoured.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यत्वङ मधुवर्णो घर्तस्नुः पर्क्षो वहन्न आ रथो वर्तते वाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyatvaṅ madhuvarṇo ghṛtasnuḥ pṛkṣo vahann ā ratho vartate vām |
Translation: 3 Covered with gold, meath-tinted, dropping fatness, your chariot with its freight of food comes hither,

Sanskit Text: मनोजवा अश्विना वातरंहा येनातियाथो दुरितानि विश्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manojavā aśvinā vātaraṃhā yenātiyātho duritāni viśvā ||
Translation: Swift as thought, Aśvins, rapid as the tempest, wherewith ye travel over all obstructions.

Sanskit Text: यो भूयिष्ठं नासत्याभ्यां विवेष चनिष्ठम पित्वो ररते विभागे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo bhūyiṣṭhaṃ nāsatyābhyāṃ viveṣa caniṣṭham pitvo rarate vibhāghe |
Translation: 4 He who hath served most often the Nāsatyas, and gives the sweetest food at distribution,

Sanskit Text: स तोकम अस्य पीपरच छमीभिर अनूर्ध्वभासः सदम इत तुतुर्यात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tokam asya pīparac chamībhir anūrdhvabhāsaḥ sadam it tuturyāt ||
Translation: Furthers with his own holy works his offspring, and ever passes those whose flames ascend not.

Sanskit Text: सम अश्विनोर अवसा नूतनेन मयोभुवा सुप्रणीती गमेम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī ghamema |
Translation: 5 May we obtain the Aśvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy guidance.

Sanskit Text: आ नो रयिं वहतम ओत वीरान आ विश्वान्य अम्र्ता सौभगानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no rayiṃ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhaghāni ||
Translation: Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!

Sanskit Text: अश्विनाव एह गछतं नासत्या मा वि वेनतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvināv eha ghachataṃ nāsatyā mā vi venatam |
Translation: 1. YE Aśvins, hither come to us: Nāsatyas, be not disinclined.

Sanskit Text: हंसाव इव पततम आ सुतां उप ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: haṃsāv iva patatam ā sutāṃ upa ||
Translation: Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

Sanskit Text: अश्विना हरिणाव इव गौराव इवानु यवसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvinā hariṇāv iva ghaurāv ivānu yavasam |
Translation: 2 O Aśvins, like a pair of deer, like two wild cattle to the mead:

Sanskit Text: हंसाव इव पततम आ सुतां उप ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: haṃsāv iva patatam ā sutāṃ upa ||
Translation: Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

Sanskit Text: अश्विना वाजिनीवसू जुषेथां यज्ञम इष्टये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvinā vājinīvasū juṣethāṃ yajñam iṣṭaye |
Translation: 3 O Aśvins rich in gifts, accept our sacrifice to prosper it:

Sanskit Text: हंसाव इव पततम आ सुतां उप ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: haṃsāv iva patatam ā sutāṃ upa ||
Translation: Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

Sanskit Text: अत्रिर यद वाम अवरोहन्न रबीसम अजोहवीन नाधमानेव योषा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrir yad vām avarohann ṛbīsam ajohavīn nādhamāneva yoṣā |
Translation: 4 As Atri when descending to the cavern called on you loudly like a wailing woman.

Sanskit Text: शयेनस्य चिज जवसा नूतनेनागछतम अश्विना शंतमेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śyenasya cij javasā nūtanenāghachatam aśvinā śaṃtamena ||
Translation: Ye came to him, O Aśvins, with the freshest and most auspicious fleetness of a falcon.

Sanskit Text: वि जिहीष्व वनस्पते योनिः सूष्यन्त्या इव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi jihīṣva vanaspate yoniḥ sūṣyantyā iva |
Translation: 5 Tree, part asunder like the side of her who bringeth forth a child.

Sanskit Text: शरुतम मे अश्विना हवं सप्तवध्रिं च मुञ्चतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrutam me aśvinā havaṃ saptavadhriṃ ca muñcatam ||
Translation: Ye Aśvins, listen to my call: loose Saptavadhri from his bonds.

Sanskit Text: भीताय नाधमानाय रषये सप्तवध्रये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhītāya nādhamānāya ṛṣaye saptavadhraye |
Translation: 6 For Saptavadhri, for the seer affrighted when he wept and wailed,

Sanskit Text: मायाभिर अश्विना युवं वर्क्षं सं च वि चाचथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: māyābhir aśvinā yuvaṃ vṛkṣaṃ saṃ ca vi cācathaḥ ||
Translation: Ye, Aśvins, with your magic powers rent up the tree and shattered it.

Sanskit Text: यथा वातः पुष्करिणीं समिङगयति सर्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā vātaḥ puṣkariṇīṃ samiṅghayati sarvataḥ |
Translation: 7 Like as the wind on every side ruffles a pool of lotuses,

Sanskit Text: एवा ते गर्भ एजतु निरैतु दशमास्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā te gharbha ejatu niraitu daśamāsyaḥ ||
Translation: So stir in thee the babe unborn, so may the ten-month babe descend.

Sanskit Text: यथा वातो यथा वनं यथा समुद्र एजति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā vāto yathā vanaṃ yathā samudra ejati |
Translation: 8 Like as the wind, like as the wood, like as the sea is set astir,

Sanskit Text: एवा तवं दशमास्य सहावेहि जरायुणा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā tvaṃ daśamāsya sahāvehi jarāyuṇā ||
Translation: So also, ten-month babe, descend together with the after-birth.

Sanskit Text: दश मासाञ छशयानः कुमारो अधि मातरि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśa māsāñ chaśayānaḥ kumāro adhi mātari |
Translation: 9 The child who hath for ten months' time been lying in his mother's side,—

Sanskit Text: निरैतु जीवो अक्षतो जीवो जीवन्त्या अधि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niraitu jīvo akṣato jīvo jīvantyā adhi ||
Translation: May he come forth alive, unharmed, yea, living from the living dame.

Sanskit Text: महे नो अद्य बोधयोषो राये दिवित्मती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahe no adya bodhayoṣo rāye divitmatī |
Translation: 1. O HEAVENLY Dawn, awaken us to ample opulence to-day

Sanskit Text: यथा चिन नो अबोधयः सत्यश्रवसि वाय्ये सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā cin no abodhayaḥ satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte ||
Translation: Even as thou hast wakened us with Satyasravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

Sanskit Text: या सुनीथे शौचद्रथे वय औछो दुहितर दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā sunīthe śaucadrathe vy aucho duhitar divaḥ |
Translation: 2 Daughter of Heaven, thou dawnedst on Sunitha Sucadratha's son,

Sanskit Text: सा वय उछ सहीयसि सत्यश्रवसि वाय्ये सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā vy ucha sahīyasi satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte ||
Translation: So dawn thou on one mightier still, on Satyasravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

Sanskit Text: सा नो अद्याभरद्वसुर वय उछा दुहितर दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā no adyābharadvasur vy uchā duhitar divaḥ |
Translation: 3 So, bringing treasure, dawn to-day on us thou Daughter of the Sky,

Sanskit Text: यो वय औछः सहीयसि सत्यश्रवसि वाय्ये सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vy auchaḥ sahīyasi satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte ||
Translation: As thou, O mightier yet. didst shine for Satyatravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

Sanskit Text: अभि ये तवा विभावरि सतोमैर गर्णन्ति वह्नयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi ye tvā vibhāvari stomair ghṛṇanti vahnayaḥ |
Translation: 4 Here round about thee are the priests who laud thee, Bright One, with their hymns,

Sanskit Text: मघैर मघोनि सुश्रियो दामन्वन्तः सुरातयः सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maghair maghoni suśriyo dāmanvantaḥ surātayaḥ sujāte aśvasūnṛte ||
Translation: And men with gifts, O Bounteous Dame, splendid with wealth and offering much, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

Sanskit Text: यच चिद धि ते गणा इमे छदयन्ति मघत्तये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yac cid dhi te ghaṇā ime chadayanti maghattaye |
Translation: 5 Whatever these thy bands perform to please thee or to win them wealth,

Sanskit Text: परि चिद वष्टयो दधुर ददतो राधो अह्रयं सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari cid vaṣṭayo dadhur dadato rādho ahrayaṃ sujāte aśvasūnṛte ||
Translation: E’en fain they gird us round and give rich gifts which ne’er are reft away, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

Sanskit Text: ऐषु धा वीरवद यश उषो मघोनि सूरिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aiṣu dhā vīravad yaśa uṣo maghoni sūriṣu |
Translation: 6 Give to these wealthy patrons fame, O affluent Dawn, with hero sons,

Sanskit Text: ये नो राधांस्य अह्रया मघवानो अरासत सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye no rādhāṃsy ahrayā maghavāno arāsata sujāte aśvasūnṛte ||
Translation: To these our princes who have brought rich gifts ne’er to be reft away, highborn! delightful with thy steeds!

Sanskit Text: तेभ्यो दयुम्नम बर्हद यश उषो मघोन्य आ वह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tebhyo dyumnam bṛhad yaśa uṣo maghony ā vaha |
Translation: 7 Bring lofty and resplendent fame, O thou munificent Dawn, to these

Sanskit Text: ये नो राधांस्य अश्व्या गव्या भजन्त सूरयः सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye no rādhāṃsy aśvyā ghavyā bhajanta sūrayaḥ sujāte aśvasūnṛte ||
Translation: Our wealthy patrons who bestow rich gifts on us of steeds and kine, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

Sanskit Text: उत नो गोमतीर इष आ वहा दुहितर दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta no ghomatīr iṣa ā vahā duhitar divaḥ |
Translation: 8 Bring us, O Daughter of the Sky, subsistence in our herds of kine,

Sanskit Text: साकं सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिः शुक्रैः शोचद्भिर अर्चिभिः सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sākaṃ sūryasya raśmibhiḥ śukraiḥ śocadbhir arcibhiḥ sujāte aśvasūnṛte ||
Translation: Together with the sunbeams, with the shine of pure refulgent flames, highborn! delightful with thy steeds!

Sanskit Text: वय उछा दुहितर दिवो मा चिरं तनुथा अपः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vy uchā duhitar divo mā ciraṃ tanuthā apaḥ |
Translation: 9 O Daughter of the Sky, shine forth; delay not to perform thy task.

Sanskit Text: नेत तवा सतेनं यथा रिपुं तपाति सूरो अर्चिषा सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: net tvā stenaṃ yathā ripuṃ tapāti sūro arciṣā sujāte aśvasūnṛte ||
Translation: Let not the Sun with fervent heat consume thee like a robber foe, high-born! delightful with the steeds!

Sanskit Text: एतावद वेद उषस तवम भूयो वा दातुम अर्हसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etāvad ved uṣas tvam bhūyo vā dātum arhasi |
Translation: 10 So much, and more exceedingly, O Dawn, it suits thee to bestow,

Sanskit Text: या सतोत्र्भ्यो विभावर्य उछन्ती न परमीयसे सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā stotṛbhyo vibhāvary uchantī na pramīyase sujāte aśvasūnṛte ||
Translation: Thou Radiant One who ceasest not to shine for those who sing thy praise, highborn! delightful with thy steeds!

Sanskit Text: दयुतद्यामानम बर्हतीम रतेन रतावरीम अरुणप्सुं विभातीम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyutadyāmānam bṛhatīm ṛtena ṛtāvarīm aruṇapsuṃ vibhātīm |
Translation: 1. THE singers welcome with their hymns and praises the Goddess Dawn who bringeth in the sunlight,

Sanskit Text: देवीम उषसं सवर आवहन्तीम परति विप्रासो मतिभिर जरन्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devīm uṣasaṃ svar āvahantīm prati viprāso matibhir jarante ||
Translation: Sublime, by Law true to eternal Order, bright on her path, red-tinted, far-refulgent.

Sanskit Text: एषा जनं दर्शता बोधयन्ती सुगान पथः कर्ण्वती यात्य अग्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣā janaṃ darśatā bodhayantī sughān pathaḥ kṛṇvatī yāty aghre |
Translation: 2 She comes in front, fair, rousing up the people, making the pathways easy to be travelled.

Sanskit Text: बर्हद्रथा बर्हती विश्वमिन्वोषा जयोतिर यछत्य अग्रे अह्नाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhadrathā bṛhatī viśvaminvoṣā jyotir yachaty aghre ahnām ||
Translation: High, on her lofty chariot, all-impelling, Dawn gives her splendour at the days' beginning.

Sanskit Text: एषा गोभिर अरुणेभिर युजानास्रेधन्ती रयिम अप्रायु चक्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣā ghobhir aruṇebhir yujānāsredhantī rayim aprāyu cakre |
Translation: 3 She, harnessing her car with purple oxen. injuring none, hath brought perpetual riches.

Sanskit Text: पथो रदन्ती सुविताय देवी पुरुष्टुता विश्ववारा वि भाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: patho radantī suvitāya devī puruṣṭutā viśvavārā vi bhāti ||
Translation: Opening paths to happiness, the Goddess shines, praised by all, giver of every blessing.

Sanskit Text: एषा वयेनी भवति दविबर्हा आविष्क्र्ण्वाना तन्वम पुरस्तात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣā vyenī bhavati dvibarhā āviṣkṛṇvānā tanvam purastāt |
Translation: 4 With changing tints she gleams in double splendour while from the eastward she displays her body.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य पन्थाम अन्व एति साधु परजानतीव न दिशो मिनाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya panthām anv eti sādhu prajānatīva na diśo mināti ||
Translation: She travels perfectly the path of Order, nor fails to reach, as one who knows, the quarters.

Sanskit Text: एषा शुभ्रा न तन्वो विदानोर्ध्वेव सनाती दर्शये नो अस्थात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣā śubhrā na tanvo vidānordhveva snātī dṛśaye no asthāt |
Translation: 5 As conscious that her limbs are bright with bathing, she stands, as ’twere, erect that we may see her.

Sanskit Text: अप दवेषो बाधमाना तमांस्य उषा दिवो दुहिता जयोतिषागात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa dveṣo bādhamānā tamāṃsy uṣā divo duhitā jyotiṣāghāt ||
Translation: Driving away malignity and darkness, Dawn, Child of Heaven, hath come to us with lustre.

Sanskit Text: एषा परतीची दुहिता दिवो नॄन योषेव भद्रा नि रिणीते अप्सः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣā pratīcī duhitā divo nṝn yoṣeva bhadrā ni riṇīte apsaḥ |
Translation: 6 The Daughter of the Sky, like some chaste woman, bends, opposite to men, her forehead downward.

Sanskit Text: वयूर्ण्वती दाशुषे वार्याणि पुनर जयोतिर युवतिः पूर्वथाकः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyūrṇvatī dāśuṣe vāryāṇi punar jyotir yuvatiḥ pūrvathākaḥ ||
Translation: The Maid, disclosing boons to him who worships, hath brought again the daylight as aforetime.

Sanskit Text: युञ्जते मन उत युञ्जते धियो विप्रा विप्रस्य बर्हतो विपश्चितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuñjate mana uta yuñjate dhiyo viprā viprasya bṛhato vipaścitaḥ |
Translation: 1. THE priests of him the lofty Priest well-skilled in hymns harness their spirit, yea, harness their holy thoughts.

Sanskit Text: वि होत्रा दधे वयुनाविद एक इन मही देवस्य सवितुः परिष्टुतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi hotrā dadhe vayunāvid eka in mahī devasya savituḥ pariṣṭutiḥ ||
Translation: He only knowing works assigns their priestly tasks. Yea, lofty is the praise of Savitar the God.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा रूपाणि परति मुञ्चते कविः परासावीद भद्रं दविपदे चतुष्पदे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā rūpāṇi prati muñcate kaviḥ prāsāvīd bhadraṃ dvipade catuṣpade |
Translation: 2 The Sapient One arrays himself in every form: for quadruped and biped he hath brought forth good.

Sanskit Text: वि नाकम अख्यत सविता वरेण्यो ऽनु परयाणम उषसो वि राजति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi nākam akhyat savitā vareṇyo 'nu prayāṇam uṣaso vi rājati ||
Translation: Excellent Savitar hath looked on heaven's high vault, and shineth after the outgoing of the Dawn.

Sanskit Text: यस्य परयाणम अन्व अन्य इद ययुर देवा देवस्य महिमानम ओजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya prayāṇam anv anya id yayur devā devasya mahimānam ojasā |
Translation: 3 Even he, the God whose going-forth and majesty the other Deities have followed with their might,

Sanskit Text: यः पार्थिवानि विममे स एतशो रजांसि देवः सविता महित्वना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ pārthivāni vimame sa etaśo rajāṃsi devaḥ savitā mahitvanā ||
Translation: He who hath measured the terrestrial regions out by his great power, he is the Courser Savitar.

Sanskit Text: उत यासि सवितस तरीणि रोचनोत सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिः सम उच्यसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta yāsi savitas trīṇi rocanota sūryasya raśmibhiḥ sam ucyasi |
Translation: 4 To the three spheres of light thou goest, Savitar, and with the rays of Sidrya thou combinest thee.

Sanskit Text: उत रात्रीम उभयतः परीयस उत मित्रो भवसि देव धर्मभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta rātrīm ubhayataḥ parīyasa uta mitro bhavasi deva dharmabhiḥ ||
Translation: Around, on both sides thou encompassest the night: yea, thou, O God, art Mitra through thy righteous laws.

Sanskit Text: उतेशिषे परसवस्य तवम एक इद उत पूषा भवसि देव यामभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uteśiṣe prasavasya tvam eka id uta pūṣā bhavasi deva yāmabhiḥ |
Translation: 5 Over all generation thou art Lord alone: Pūṣan art thou, O God, in all thy goings-forth.
