Sanskit Text: उतेदं विश्वम भुवनं वि राजसि शयावाश्वस ते सवित सतोमम आनशे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utedaṃ viśvam bhuvanaṃ vi rājasi śyāvāśvas te savita stomam ānaśe ||
Translation: Yea, thou hast domination over all this world. Śyāvāśva hath brought praise to thee, O Savitar,

Sanskit Text: तत सवितुर वर्णीमहे वयं देवस्य भोजनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat savitur vṛṇīmahe vayaṃ devasya bhojanam |
Translation: 1. WE crave of Savitar the God this treasure much to be enjoyed.

Sanskit Text: शरेष्ठं सर्वधातमं तुरम भगस्य धीमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śreṣṭhaṃ sarvadhātamaṃ turam bhaghasya dhīmahi ||
Translation: The best, all-yielding, conquering gift of Bhaga we would gladly win.

Sanskit Text: अस्य हि सवयशस्तरं सवितुः कच चन परियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya hi svayaśastaraṃ savituḥ kac cana priyam |
Translation: 2 Savitar's own supremacy, most glorious and beloved of all,

Sanskit Text: न मिनन्ति सवराज्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na minanti svarājyam ||
Translation: No one diminisheth in aught.

Sanskit Text: स हि रत्नानि दाशुषे सुवाति सविता भगः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi ratnāni dāśuṣe suvāti savitā bhaghaḥ |
Translation: 3 For Savitar who is Bhaga shall send riches to his worshipper.

Sanskit Text: तम भागं चित्रम ईमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tam bhāghaṃ citram īmahe ||
Translation: That wondrous portion we implore.

Sanskit Text: अद्या नो देव सवितः परजावत सावीः सौभगम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adyā no deva savitaḥ prajāvat sāvīḥ saubhagham |
Translation: 4 Send us this day, God Savitar, prosperity with progeny.

Sanskit Text: परा दुष्वप्न्यं सुव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parā duṣvapnyaṃ suva ||
Translation: Drive thou the evil dream away.

Sanskit Text: विश्वानि देव सवितर दुरितानि परा सुव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāni deva savitar duritāni parā suva |
Translation: 5 Savitar, God, send far away all sorrows and calamities,

Sanskit Text: यद भद्रं तन न आ सुव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad bhadraṃ tan na ā suva ||
Translation: And send us only what is good.

Sanskit Text: अनागसो अदितये देवस्य सवितुः सवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anāghaso aditaye devasya savituḥ save |
Translation: 6 Sinless in sight of Aditi through the God Savitar's influence,

Sanskit Text: विश्वा वामानि धीमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi ||
Translation: May we obtain all lovely things.

Sanskit Text: आ विश्वदेवं सत्पतिं सूक्तैर अद्या वर्णीमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā viśvadevaṃ satpatiṃ sūktair adyā vṛṇīmahe |
Translation: 7 We with our hymns this day elect the general God, Lord of the good,

Sanskit Text: सत्यसवं सवितारम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satyasavaṃ savitāram ||
Translation: Savitar whose decrees are true.

Sanskit Text: य इमे उभे अहनी पुर एत्य अप्रयुछन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya ime ubhe ahanī pura ety aprayuchan |
Translation: 8 He who for ever vigilant precedes these Twain, the Day and Night,

Sanskit Text: सवाधीर देवः सविता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svādhīr devaḥ savitā ||
Translation: Is Savitar the thoughtful God.

Sanskit Text: य इमा विश्वा जातान्य आश्रावयति शलोकेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya imā viśvā jātāny āśrāvayati ślokena |
Translation: 9 He who gives glory unto all these living creatures with the song,

Sanskit Text: पर च सुवाति सविता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ca suvāti savitā ||
Translation: And brings them forth, is Savitar.

Sanskit Text: अछा वद तवसं गीर्भिर आभि सतुहि पर्जन्यं नमसा विवास |
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā vada tavasaṃ ghīrbhir ābhi stuhi parjanyaṃ namasā vivāsa |
Translation: 1. SING with these songs thy welcome to the Mighty, with adoration praise and call Parjanya.

Sanskit Text: कनिक्रदद वर्षभो जीरदानू रेतो दधात्य ओषधीषु गर्भम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kanikradad vṛṣabho jīradānū reto dadhāty oṣadhīṣu gharbham ||
Translation: The Bull, loud roaring, swift to send his bounty, lays in the plants the seed. for germination.

Sanskit Text: वि वर्क्षान हन्त्य उत हन्ति रक्षसो विश्वम बिभाय भुवनम महावधात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi vṛkṣān hanty uta hanti rakṣaso viśvam bibhāya bhuvanam mahāvadhāt |
Translation: 2 He smites the trees apart, he slays the demons: all life fears him who wields the mighty weapon.

Sanskit Text: उतानागा ईषते वर्ष्ण्यावतो यत पर्जन्य सतनयन हन्ति दुष्क्र्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utānāghā īṣate vṛṣṇyāvato yat parjanya stanayan hanti duṣkṛtaḥ ||
Translation: From him exceeding strong fices e’en the guiltless, when thundering Parjanya smites the wicked.

Sanskit Text: रथीव कशयाश्वां अभिक्षिपन्न आविर दूतान कर्णुते वर्ष्य्रं अह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathīva kaśayāśvāṃ abhikṣipann āvir dūtān kṛṇute varṣyṛṃ aha |
Translation: 3 Like a car-driver whipping on his horses, he makes the messengers of rain spring forward.

Sanskit Text: दूरात सिंहस्य सतनथा उद ईरते यत पर्जन्यः कर्णुते वर्ष्यं नभः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūrāt siṃhasya stanathā ud īrate yat parjanyaḥ kṛṇute varṣyaṃ nabhaḥ ||
Translation: Far off resounds the roaring of the lion, what time Parjanya fills the sky with rain-cloud.

Sanskit Text: पर वाता वान्ति पतयन्ति विद्युत उद ओषधीर जिहते पिन्वते सवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vātā vānti patayanti vidyuta ud oṣadhīr jihate pinvate svaḥ |
Translation: 4 Forth burst the winds, down come the lightning-flashes: the plants shoot up, the realm of light is streaming.

Sanskit Text: इरा विश्वस्मै भुवनाय जायते यत पर्जन्यः पर्थिवीं रेतसावति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: irā viśvasmai bhuvanāya jāyate yat parjanyaḥ pṛthivīṃ retasāvati ||
Translation: Food springs abundant for all living creatures, what time Parjanya quickens earth with moisture.

Sanskit Text: यस्य वरते पर्थिवी नन्नमीति यस्य वरते शफवज जर्भुरीति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya vrate pṛthivī nannamīti yasya vrate śaphavaj jarbhurīti |
Translation: 5 Thou at whose bidding earth bows low before thee, at whose command hoofed cattle fly in terror,

Sanskit Text: यस्य वरत ओषधीर विश्वरूपाः स नः पर्जन्य महि शर्म यछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya vrata oṣadhīr viśvarūpāḥ sa naḥ parjanya mahi śarma yacha ||
Translation: At whose behest the plants assume all colours, even thou Parjanya, yield us great protection.

Sanskit Text: दिवो नो वर्ष्टिम मरुतो ररीध्वम पर पिन्वत वर्ष्णो अश्वस्य धाराः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo no vṛṣṭim maruto rarīdhvam pra pinvata vṛṣṇo aśvasya dhārāḥ |
Translation: 6 Send down for us the rain of heaven, ye Maruts, and let the Stallion's flood descend in torrents.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाङ एतेन सतनयित्नुनेह्य अपो निषिञ्चन्न असुरः पिता नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāṅ etena stanayitnunehy apo niṣiñcann asuraḥ pitā naḥ ||
Translation: Come hither with this thunder while thou pourest the waters down, our heavenly Lord and Father.

Sanskit Text: अभि करन्द सतनय गर्भम आ धा उदन्वता परि दीया रथेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi kranda stanaya gharbham ā dhā udanvatā pari dīyā rathena |
Translation: 7 Thunder and roar: the germ of life deposit. Fly round us on thy chariot waterladen.

Sanskit Text: दर्तिं सु कर्ष विषितं नयञ्चं समा भवन्तूद्वतो निपादाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dṛtiṃ su karṣa viṣitaṃ nyañcaṃ samā bhavantūdvato nipādāḥ ||
Translation: Thine opened water-skin draw with thee downward, and let the hollows and the heights be level.

Sanskit Text: महान्तं कोशम उद अचा नि षिञ्च सयन्दन्तां कुल्या विषिताः पुरस्तात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahāntaṃ kośam ud acā ni ṣiñca syandantāṃ kulyā viṣitāḥ purastāt |
Translation: 8 Lift up the mighty vessel, pour down water, and let the liberated streams rush forward.

Sanskit Text: घर्तेन दयावाप्र्थिवी वय उन्धि सुप्रपाणम भवत्व अघ्न्याभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī vy undhi suprapāṇam bhavatv aghnyābhyaḥ ||
Translation: Saturate both the earth and heaven with fatness, and for the cows let there be drink abundant.

Sanskit Text: यत पर्जन्य कनिक्रदत सतनयन हंसि दुष्क्र्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat parjanya kanikradat stanayan haṃsi duṣkṛtaḥ |
Translation: 9 When thou, with thunder and with roar, Parjanya, smitest sinners down,

Sanskit Text: परतीदं विश्वम मोदते यत किं च पर्थिव्याम अधि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratīdaṃ viśvam modate yat kiṃ ca pṛthivyām adhi ||
Translation: This universe exults thereat, yea, all that is upon the earth.

Sanskit Text: अवर्षीर वर्षम उद उ षू गर्भायाकर धन्वान्य अत्येतवा उ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avarṣīr varṣam ud u ṣū ghṛbhāyākar dhanvāny atyetavā u |
Translation: 10 Thou hast poured down the rain-flood now withhold it. Thou hast made desert places fit for travel.

Sanskit Text: अजीजन ओषधीर भोजनाय कम उत परजाभ्यो ऽविदो मनीषाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajījana oṣadhīr bhojanāya kam uta prajābhyo 'vido manīṣām ||
Translation: Thou hast made herbs to grow for our enjoyment: yea, thou hast won thee praise from living creatures.

Sanskit Text: बळ इत्था पर्वतानां खिद्रम बिभर्षि पर्थिवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: baḷ itthā parvatānāṃ khidram bibharṣi pṛthivi |
Translation: 1. THOU, of a truth,O Prthivi, bearest the tool that rends the hills:

Sanskit Text: पर या भूमिम परवत्वति मह्ना जिनोषि महिनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yā bhūmim pravatvati mahnā jinoṣi mahini ||
Translation: Thou rich in torrents, who with might quickenest earth, O Mighty One.

Sanskit Text: सतोमासस तवा विचारिणि परति षटोभन्त्य अक्तुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stomāsas tvā vicāriṇi prati ṣṭobhanty aktubhiḥ |
Translation: 2 To thee, O wanderer at will, ring out the lauds with beams of day,

Sanskit Text: पर या वाजं न हेषन्तम पेरुम अस्यस्य अर्जुनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yā vājaṃ na heṣantam perum asyasy arjuni ||
Translation: Who drivest, like a neighing steed, the swelling cloud, O bright of hue.

Sanskit Text: दर्ळ्हा चिद या वनस्पतीन कष्मया दर्धर्ष्य ओजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dṛḷhā cid yā vanaspatīn kṣmayā dardharṣy ojasā |
Translation: 3 Who graspest with thy might on earth. e’en the strong sovrans of the wood,

Sanskit Text: यत ते अभ्रस्य विद्युतो दिवो वर्षन्ति वर्ष्टयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te abhrasya vidyuto divo varṣanti vṛṣṭayaḥ ||
Translation: When from the lightning of thy cloud the rain-floods of the heaven descend.

Sanskit Text: पर सम्राजे बर्हद अर्चा गभीरम बरह्म परियं वरुणाय शरुताय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra samrāje bṛhad arcā ghabhīram brahma priyaṃ varuṇāya śrutāya |
Translation: 1. SING forth a hymn sublime and solemn, grateful to glorious. Varuṇa, imperial Ruler,

Sanskit Text: वि यो जघान शमितेव चर्मोपस्तिरे पर्थिवीं सूर्याय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yo jaghāna śamiteva carmopastire pṛthivīṃ sūryāya ||
Translation: Who hath struck out, like one who slays the victim, earth as a skin to spread in front of Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: वनेषु वय अन्तरिक्षं ततान वाजम अर्वत्सु पय उस्रियासु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaneṣu vy antarikṣaṃ tatāna vājam arvatsu paya usriyāsu |
Translation: 2 In the tree-tops the air he hath extended, put milk in kine and vigorous speed in horses,

Sanskit Text: हर्त्सु करतुं वरुणो अप्स्व अग्निं दिवि सूर्यम अदधात सोमम अद्रौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hṛtsu kratuṃ varuṇo apsv aghniṃ divi sūryam adadhāt somam adrau ||
Translation: Set intellect in hearts, fire in the waters, Siurya in heaven and Soma on the mountain.

Sanskit Text: नीचीनबारं वरुणः कवन्धम पर ससर्ज रोदसी अन्तरिक्षम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nīcīnabāraṃ varuṇaḥ kavandham pra sasarja rodasī antarikṣam |
Translation: 3 Varuṇa lets the big cask, opening downward, flow through the heaven and earth and air's mid-region.

Sanskit Text: तेन विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा यवं न वर्ष्टिर वय उनत्ति भूम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tena viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā yavaṃ na vṛṣṭir vy unatti bhūma ||
Translation: Therewith the universe's Sovran waters earth as the shower of rain bedews the barley.

Sanskit Text: उनत्ति भूमिम पर्थिवीम उत दयां यदा दुग्धं वरुणो वष्ट्य आद इत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: unatti bhūmim pṛthivīm uta dyāṃ yadā dughdhaṃ varuṇo vaṣṭy ād it |
Translation: 4 When Varuṇa is fain for milk he moistens the sky, the land, and earth to her foundation.

Sanskit Text: सम अभ्रेण वसत पर्वतासस तविषीयन्तः शरथयन्त वीराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sam abhreṇa vasata parvatāsas taviṣīyantaḥ śrathayanta vīrāḥ ||
Translation: Then straight the mountains clothe them in the rain-cloud: the Heroes, putting forth their vigour, loose them.

Sanskit Text: इमाम ऊ षव रसुरस्य शरुतस्य महीम मायां वरुणस्य पर वोचम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imām ū ṣv ṛsurasya śrutasya mahīm māyāṃ varuṇasya pra vocam |
Translation: 5 I will declare this mighty deed of magic, of glorious Varuṇa the Lord Immortal,

Sanskit Text: मानेनेव तस्थिवां अन्तरिक्षे वि यो ममे पर्थिवीं सूर्येण ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: māneneva tasthivāṃ antarikṣe vi yo mame pṛthivīṃ sūryeṇa ||
Translation: Who standing in the firmament hath meted the earth out with the Sun as with a measure.

Sanskit Text: इमाम ऊ नु कवितमस्य मायाम महीं देवस्य नकिर आ दधर्ष |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imām ū nu kavitamasya māyām mahīṃ devasya nakir ā dadharṣa |
Translation: 6 None, verily, hath ever let or hindered this the most wise God's mighty deed of magic,

Sanskit Text: एकं यद उद्ना न पर्णन्त्य एनीर आसिञ्चन्तीर अवनयः समुद्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ekaṃ yad udnā na pṛṇanty enīr āsiñcantīr avanayaḥ samudram ||
Translation: Whereby with all their flood, the lucid rivers fill not one sea wherein they pour their waters.

Sanskit Text: अर्यम्यं वरुण मित्र्यं वा सखायं वा सदम इद भरातरं वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aryamyaṃ varuṇa mitryaṃ vā sakhāyaṃ vā sadam id bhrātaraṃ vā |
Translation: 7 If we have sinned against the man who loves us, have ever wronged a brother, friend, or comrade,

Sanskit Text: वेशं वा नित्यं वरुणारणं वा यत सीम आगश चक्र्मा शिश्रथस तत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: veśaṃ vā nityaṃ varuṇāraṇaṃ vā yat sīm āghaś cakṛmā śiśrathas tat ||
Translation: The neighbour ever with us, or a stranger, O Varuṇa, remove from us the trespass.

Sanskit Text: कितवासो यद रिरिपुर न दीवि यद वा घा सत्यम उत यन न विद्म |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kitavāso yad riripur na dīvi yad vā ghā satyam uta yan na vidma |
Translation: 8 If we, as gamesters cheat at play, have cheated, done wrong unwittingly or sinned of purpose,

Sanskit Text: सर्वा ता वि षय शिथिरेव देवाधा ते सयाम वरुण परियासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarvā tā vi ṣya śithireva devādhā te syāma varuṇa priyāsaḥ ||
Translation: Cast all these sins away like loosened fetters, and, Varuṇa let us be thine own beloved.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी यम अवथ उभा वाजेषु मर्त्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī yam avatha ubhā vājeṣu martyam |
Translation: 1. THE mortal man whom ye, the Twain, Indra and Agni, help in fight,

Sanskit Text: दर्ळ्हा चित स पर भेदति दयुम्ना वाणीर इव तरितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dṛḷhā cit sa pra bhedati dyumnā vāṇīr iva tritaḥ ||
Translation: Breaks through e’en strongly-guarded wealth as Tṛta burst his way through reeds.

Sanskit Text: या पर्तनासु दुष्टरा या वाजेषु शरवाय्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā pṛtanāsu duṣṭarā yā vājeṣu śravāyyā |
Translation: 2 The Twain invincible in war, worthy to be renowned in frays,

Sanskit Text: या पञ्च चर्षणीर अभॄन्द्राग्नी ता हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā pañca carṣaṇīr abhṝndrāghnī tā havāmahe ||
Translation: Lords of the Fivefold. People, these, Indra and Agni, we invoke.

Sanskit Text: तयोर इद अमवच छवस तिग्मा दिद्युन मघोनोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tayor id amavac chavas tighmā didyun maghonoḥ |
Translation: 3 Impetuous is their strength, and keen the lightning of the mighty Pair,

Sanskit Text: परति दरुणा गभस्त्योर गवां वर्त्रघ्न एषते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati druṇā ghabhastyor ghavāṃ vṛtraghna eṣate ||
Translation: Which from their arms speeds with the car to Vṛtra's slayer for the kine.

Sanskit Text: ता वाम एषे रथानाम इन्द्राग्नी हवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā vām eṣe rathānām indrāghnī havāmahe |
Translation: 4 Indra and Agni, we invoke you both, as such, to send your cars:

Sanskit Text: पती तुरस्य राधसो विद्वांसा गिर्वणस्तमा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: patī turasya rādhaso vidvāṃsā ghirvaṇastamā ||
Translation: Lords of quick-coming bounty, ye who know, chief lovers of the song.

Sanskit Text: ता वर्धन्ताव अनु दयून मर्ताय देवाव अदभा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā vṛdhantāv anu dyūn martāya devāv adabhā |
Translation: 5 These who give increase day by day, Gods without guile for mortal man,

Sanskit Text: अर्हन्ता चित पुरो दधे ऽंशेव देवाव अर्वते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arhantā cit puro dadhe 'ṃśeva devāv arvate ||
Translation: Worthy themselves, I honour most, Two Gods as partners, for my horse.

Sanskit Text: एवेन्द्राग्निभ्याम अहावि हव्यं शूष्यं घर्तं न पूतम अद्रिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evendrāghnibhyām ahāvi havyaṃ śūṣyaṃ ghṛtaṃ na pūtam adribhiḥ |
Translation: 6 The strength-bestowing offering thus to Indra-Agni hath been paid, as butter, purified by stones.

Sanskit Text: ता सूरिषु शरवो बर्हद रयिं गर्णत्सु दिध्र्तम इषं गर्णत्सु दिध्र्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā sūriṣu śravo bṛhad rayiṃ ghṛṇatsu didhṛtam iṣaṃ ghṛṇatsu didhṛtam ||
Translation: Deal to our princes high renown, deal wealth to those who sing your praise, deal food to those who sing your praise.

Sanskit Text: तवं हयग्ने परथमो मनोतास्या धियो अभवो दस्म होता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hyaghne prathamo manotāsyā dhiyo abhavo dasma hotā |
Translation: 1. THOU, first inventor of this prayer, O Agni, Worker of Marvels, hast become our Herald.

Sanskit Text: तवं सीं वर्षन्नक्र्णोर्दुष्टरीतु सहो विश्वस्मै सहसे सहध्यै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ sīṃ vṛṣannakṛṇorduṣṭarītu saho viśvasmai sahase sahadhyai ||
Translation: Thou, Bull, hast made us strength which none may conquer, strength that shall overcome all other prowess.

Sanskit Text: अधा होता नयसीदो यजीयानिळस पद इषयन्नीड्यः सन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā hotā nyasīdo yajīyāniḷas pada iṣayannīḍyaḥ san |
Translation: 2 As Priest thou sattest at the seat of worship, furthering us, best Offerer, meet for honour.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा नरः परथमं देवयन्तो महो राये चितयन्तो अनु गमन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā naraḥ prathamaṃ devayanto maho rāye citayanto anu ghman ||
Translation: So first to thee have pious men resorted, turning thy mind to thoughts of ample riches.

Sanskit Text: वर्तेव यन्तं बहुभिर्वसव्यैस्त्वे रयिं जाग्र्वांसो अनु गमन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛteva yantaṃ bahubhirvasavyaistve rayiṃ jāghṛvāṃso anu ghman |
Translation: 3 In thee, still watching, they have followed riches, who goest with much wealth as with an army,

Sanskit Text: रुशन्तमग्निं दर्शतं बर्हन्तं वपावन्तं विश्वहा दीदिवांसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ruśantamaghniṃ darśataṃ bṛhantaṃ vapāvantaṃ viśvahā dīdivāṃsam ||
Translation: The radiant Agni, lofty, fair to look on, worshipped with marrow, evermore resplendent.

Sanskit Text: पदं देवस्य नमसा वयन्तः शरवस्यवः शरव आपन्नम्र्क्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: padaṃ devasya namasā vyantaḥ śravasyavaḥ śrava āpannamṛktam |
Translation: 4 They who approached the God's abode with homage, eager for glory, won them perfect glory:

Sanskit Text: नामानि चिद दधिरे यज्ञियानि भद्रायां ते रणयन्तसन्द्र्ष्टौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāmāni cid dadhire yajñiyāni bhadrāyāṃ te raṇayantasandṛṣṭau ||
Translation: Yea, they gained even sacrificial titles, and found delight in thine auspicious aspect.

Sanskit Text: तवां वर्धन्ति कषितयः पर्थिव्यां तवां राय उभयासो जनानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ vardhanti kṣitayaḥ pṛthivyāṃ tvāṃ rāya ubhayāso janānām |
Translation: 5 On earth the people magnify thee greatly, thee their celestial and terrestrial riches.

Sanskit Text: तवं तराता तरणे चेत्यो भूः पिता माता सदमिन मानुषाणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ trātā taraṇe cetyo bhūḥ pitā mātā sadamin mānuṣāṇām ||
Translation: Thou, Helper, must be known as our Preserver, Father and Mother of mankind for ever.

Sanskit Text: सपर्येण्यः स परियो विक्ष्वग्निर्होता मन्द्रो नि षसादा यजीयान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saparyeṇyaḥ sa priyo vikṣvaghnirhotā mandro ni ṣasādā yajīyān |
Translation: 6 Dear priest among mankind, adorable Agni hath seated him, joy-giver, skilled in worship.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा वयं दम आ दीदिवांसमुप जञुबाधो नमसा सदेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā vayaṃ dama ā dīdivāṃsamupa jñubādho namasā sadema ||
Translation: Let us approach thee shining in thy dwelling, kneeling upon our knees, with adoration.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा वयं सुध्यो नव्यमग्ने-सुम्नायव ईमहे देवयन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā vayaṃ sudhyo navyamaghne-sumnāyava īmahe devayantaḥ |
Translation: 7 Longing for bliss, pure-minded, God-devoted, Agni, we seek thee, such, meet to be lauded.

Sanskit Text: तवं विशो अनयो दीद्यानो दिवो अग्ने बर्हता रोचनेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ viśo anayo dīdyāno divo aghne bṛhatā rocanena ||
Translation: Thou, Agni, leddest forth our men to battle, refulgent with the heaven's exalted splendour.

Sanskit Text: विशां कविं विश्पतिं शश्वतीनां नितोशनं वर्षभं चर्षणीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśāṃ kaviṃ viśpatiṃ śaśvatīnāṃ nitośanaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ carṣaṇīnām |
Translation: 8 Sage of mankind, all peoples' Lord and Master, the Bull of men, the sender down of blessings,

Sanskit Text: परेतीषणिमिषयन्तं पावकं राजन्तमग्निं यजतं रयीणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pretīṣaṇimiṣayantaṃ pāvakaṃ rājantamaghniṃ yajataṃ rayīṇām ||
Translation: Still pressing on, promoting, purifying, Agni the Holy One, the Lord of riches.

Sanskit Text: सो अग्न ईजे शशमे च मर्तो यस्त आनट समिधा हव्यदातिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: so aghna īje śaśame ca marto yasta ānaṭ samidhā havyadātim |
Translation: 9 Agni, the mortal who hath toiled and worshipped, brought thee oblations with his kindled fuel,

Sanskit Text: य आहुतिं परि वेदा नमोभिर्विश्वेत स वामा दधतेत्वोतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya āhutiṃ pari vedā namobhirviśvet sa vāmā dadhatetvotaḥ ||
Translation: And well knows sacrifice with adoration, gains every joy with thee to guard and help him.

Sanskit Text: अस्मा उ ते महि महे विधेम नमोभिरग्ने समिधोत हव्यैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmā u te mahi mahe vidhema namobhiraghne samidhota havyaiḥ |
Translation: 10 Mightily let us worship thee the Mighty, with reverence, Agni! fuel and oblations,

Sanskit Text: वेदी सूनो सहसो गीर्भिरुक्थैरा ते भद्रायां सुमतौयतेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vedī sūno sahaso ghīrbhirukthairā te bhadrāyāṃ sumatauyatema ||
Translation: With songs, O Son of Strength, with hymns, with altar: so may we strive for thine auspicious favour.

Sanskit Text: आ यस्ततन्थ रोदसी वि भासा शरवोभिश्च शरवस्यस्तरुत्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yastatantha rodasī vi bhāsā śravobhiśca śravasyastarutraḥ |
Translation: 11 Thou who hast covered heaven and earth with splendour and with thy glories, glorious and triumphant.

Sanskit Text: बर्हद्भिर्वाजै सथविरेभिरस्मे रेवद्भिरग्ने वितरं वि भाहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhadbhirvājai sthavirebhirasme revadbhiraghne vitaraṃ vi bhāhi ||
Translation: Continue thou to shine on us, O Agni, with strength abundant, rich, and long enduring.

Sanskit Text: नर्वद वसो सदमिद धेह्यस्मे भूरि तोकाय तनयाय पश्वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛvad vaso sadamid dhehyasme bhūri tokāya tanayāya paśvaḥ |
Translation: 12 Vouchsafe us ever, as man needs, O Vasu, abundant wealth of kine for son and offspring.

Sanskit Text: पूर्वीरिषो बर्हतीरारेघा अस्मे भद्रा सौश्रवसानि सन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvīriṣo bṛhatīrāreaghā asme bhadrā sauśravasāni santu ||
Translation: Food noble, plenteous, far from sin and evil, he with us, and fair fame to make us happy.

Sanskit Text: पुरूण्यग्ने पुरुधा तवाया वसूनि राजन वसुता ते अश्याम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purūṇyaghne purudhā tvāyā vasūni rājan vasutā te aśyām |
Translation: 13 May I obtain much wealth in many places by love of thee and through thy grace, King Agni;

Sanskit Text: पुरूणि हि तवे पुरुवार सन्त्यग्ने वसु विधते राजनि तवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purūṇi hi tve puruvāra santyaghne vasu vidhate rājani tve ||
Translation: For in thee Bounteous One, in thee the Sovran, Agni, are many boons for him who serves thee.

Sanskit Text: तवं हि कषैतवद यशो.अग्ने मित्रो न पत्यसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hi kṣaitavad yaśo.aghne mitro na patyase |
Translation: 1. THOU, Agni, even as Mitra, hast a princely glory of thine own.

Sanskit Text: तवं विचर्षणे शरवो वसो पुष्टिं न पुष्यसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ vicarṣaṇe śravo vaso puṣṭiṃ na puṣyasi ||
Translation: Thou, active Vasu, makest fame increase like full prosperity.

Sanskit Text: तवां हि षमा चर्षणयो यज्ञेभिर्गीर्भिरीळते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ hi ṣmā carṣaṇayo yajñebhirghīrbhirīḷate |
Translation: 2 For, verily, men pray to thee with sacrifices and with songs.

Sanskit Text: तवां वाजी यात्यव्र्को रजस्तूर्विश्वचर्षणिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ vājī yātyavṛko rajastūrviśvacarṣaṇiḥ ||
Translation: To thee the Friendly Courser, seen of all, comes speeding through the air.

Sanskit Text: सजोषस्त्वा दिवो नरो यज्ञस्य केतुमिन्धते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣastvā divo naro yajñasya ketumindhate |
Translation: 3 Of one accord men kindle thee Heaven's signal of the sacrifice,

Sanskit Text: यद ध सय मानुषो जनः सुम्नायुर्जुह्वे अध्वरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad dha sya mānuṣo janaḥ sumnāyurjuhve adhvare ||
Translation: When, craving bliss, this race of man invites thee to the solemn rite.

Sanskit Text: रधद यस्ते सुदानवे धिया मर्तः शशमते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛdhad yaste sudānave dhiyā martaḥ śaśamate |
Translation: 4 Let the man thrive who travails sore, in prayer, far thee the Bountiful.

Sanskit Text: ऊती ष बर्हतो दिवो दविषो अंहो न तरति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūtī ṣa bṛhato divo dviṣo aṃho na tarati ||
Translation: He with the help of lofty Dyaus comes safe through straits of enmity.

Sanskit Text: समिधा यस्त आहुतिं निशितिं मर्त्यो नशत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samidhā yasta āhutiṃ niśitiṃ martyo naśat |
Translation: 5 The mortal who with fuel lights thy flame and offers unto thee,

Sanskit Text: वयावन्तंस पुष्यति कषयमग्ने शतायुषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayāvantaṃsa puṣyati kṣayamaghne śatāyuṣam ||
Translation: Supports a house with many a branch, Agni, to live a hundred years.

Sanskit Text: तवेषस्ते धूम रण्वति दिवि षञ्छुक्र आततः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tveṣaste dhūma ṛṇvati divi ṣañchukra ātataḥ |
Translation: 6 Thy bright smoke lifts itself aloft, and far-extended shines in heaven.

Sanskit Text: सूरो न हि दयुता तवं कर्पा पावक रोचसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūro na hi dyutā tvaṃ kṛpā pāvaka rocase ||
Translation: For, Purifier! like the Sun thou beamest with thy radiant glow.

Sanskit Text: अधा हि विक्ष्वीड्यो.असि परियो नो अतिथिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā hi vikṣvīḍyo.asi priyo no atithiḥ |
Translation: 7 For in men's houses thou must be glorified as a well-loved guest,

Sanskit Text: रण्वः पुरीव जूर्यः सूनुर्न तरययाय्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: raṇvaḥ purīva jūryaḥ sūnurna trayayāyyaḥ ||
Translation: Gay like an elder in a fort, claiming protection like a son.

Sanskit Text: करत्वा हि दरोणे अज्यसे.अग्ने वाजी न कर्त्व्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratvā hi droṇe ajyase.aghne vājī na kṛtvyaḥ |
Translation: 8 Thou, Agni, like an able steed, art urged by wisdom in the wood.

Sanskit Text: परिज्मेवस्वधा गयो.अत्यो न हवार्यः शिशुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parijmevasvadhā ghayo.atyo na hvāryaḥ śiśuḥ ||
Translation: Thou art like wind; food, home art thou, like a young horse that runs astray.

Sanskit Text: तवं तया चिदच्युताग्ने पशुर्न यवसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tyā cidacyutāghne paśurna yavase |
Translation: 9 E’en things imperishable, thou, O Agni, like a gazing ox,

Sanskit Text: धामा ह यत ते अजर वना वर्श्चन्ति शिक्वसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhāmā ha yat te ajara vanā vṛścanti śikvasaḥ ||
Translation: Eatest, when hosts, Eternal One! of thee the Mighty rend the woods.

Sanskit Text: वेषि हयध्वरीयतामग्ने होता दमे विशाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: veṣi hyadhvarīyatāmaghne hotā dame viśām |
Translation: 10 Agni, thou enterest as Priest the home of men who sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: सम्र्धो विश्पते कर्णु जुषस्व हव्यमङगिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samṛdho viśpate kṛṇu juṣasva havyamaṅghiraḥ ||
Translation: Lord of the people, prosper them. Accept the ofrering, Aṅgiras!

Sanskit Text: अछा नो मित्रमहो देव देवानग्ने वोचः सुमतिं रोदस्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā no mitramaho deva devānaghne vocaḥ sumatiṃ rodasyoḥ |
Translation: 11 O Agni, God with Mitra's might, call hither the favour of the Gods from earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: वीहि सवस्तिं सुक्षितिं दिवो नॄन दविषो अंहांसि दुरितातरेम ता तरेम तवावसा तरेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vīhi svastiṃ sukṣitiṃ divo nṝn dviṣo aṃhāṃsi duritātarema tā tarema tavāvasā tarema ||
Translation: Bring weal from heaven, that men may dwell securely. May we o’ercome the foe's malign oppressions, may we o’ercome them, through thy help o’ercome them.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने स कषेषद रतपा रतेजा उरु जयोतिर्नशते देवयुष टे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne sa kṣeṣad ṛtapā ṛtejā uru jyotirnaśate devayuṣ ṭe |
Translation: 1. TRUE, guardian of the Law, thy faithful servant wins ample light and dwells in peace, O Agni,

Sanskit Text: यं तवं मित्रेण वरुणः सजोषा देव पासि तयजसा मर्तमंहः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ tvaṃ mitreṇa varuṇaḥ sajoṣā deva pāsi tyajasā martamaṃhaḥ ||
Translation: Whom thou, as Varuṇa in accord with Mitra, guardest, O God, by banishing his trouble.

Sanskit Text: ईजे यज्ञेभिह शशमे शमीभिर्र्धद्वारायाग्नये ददाश |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īje yajñebhih śaśame śamībhirṛdhadvārāyāghnaye dadāśa |
Translation: 2 He hath paid sacrifices, toiled in worship, and offered gifts to wealth-increasing Agni.

Sanskit Text: एवा चन तं यशसामजुष्टिर्नांहो मर्तं नशते न परद्र्प्तिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā cana taṃ yaśasāmajuṣṭirnāṃho martaṃ naśate na pradṛptiḥ ||
Translation: Him the displeasure of the famous moves not, outrage and scorn affect not such a mortal.

Sanskit Text: सूरो न यस्य दर्शतिररेपा भीमा यदेति शुचतस्त आ धीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūro na yasya dṛśatirarepā bhīmā yadeti śucatasta ā dhīḥ |
Translation: 3 Bright God, whose look is free from stain like Sūrya's, thou, swift, what time thou earnestly desirest,

Sanskit Text: हेषस्वतः शुरुधो नायमक्तोः कुत्रा चिद रण्वो वसतिर्वनेजाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: heṣasvataḥ śurudho nāyamaktoḥ kutrā cid raṇvo vasatirvanejāḥ ||
Translation: Hast gear to give us. Come with joy at evening, where, Child of Wood, thou mayest also tarry.

Sanskit Text: तिग्मं चिदेम महि वर्पो अस्य भसदश्वो न यमसान आसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tighmaṃ cidema mahi varpo asya bhasadaśvo na yamasāna āsā |
Translation: 4 Fierce is his gait and vast his wondrous body: he champeth like a horse with bit and bridle,

Sanskit Text: विजेहमानः परशुर्न जिह्वां दरविर्न दरावयति दारु धक्षत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vijehamānaḥ paraśurna jihvāṃ dravirna drāvayati dāru dhakṣat ||
Translation: And, darting forth his tongue, as ’twere a hatchet, burning the woods, smelteth them like a smelter.

Sanskit Text: स इदस्तेव परति धादसिष्यञ्छिशीत तेजो.अयसो न धाराम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa idasteva prati dhādasiṣyañchiśīta tejo.ayaso na dhārām |
Translation: 5 Archer-like, fain toshoot, he sets his arrow, and whets his splendour like the edge of iron:

Sanskit Text: चित्रध्रजतिररतिर्यो अक्तोर्वेर्न दरुषद्वा रघुपत्मजंहाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: citradhrajatiraratiryo aktorverna druṣadvā raghupatmajaṃhāḥ ||
Translation: The messenger of night with brilliant pathway, like a tree-roosting bird of rapid pinion.

Sanskit Text: स ईं रेभो न परति वस्त उस्राः शोचिषा रारपीति मित्रमहाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa īṃ rebho na prati vasta usrāḥ śociṣā rārapīti mitramahāḥ |
Translation: 6 In beams of morn he clothes him like the singer, and bright as Mitra with his splendour crackles.

Sanskit Text: नक्तं य ईमरुषो यो दिवा नॄनमर्त्यो अरुषो यो दिवा नॄन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: naktaṃ ya īmaruṣo yo divā nṝnamartyo aruṣo yo divā nṝn ||
Translation: Red in the night, by day the men's possession: red, he belongs to men by day, Immortal.

Sanskit Text: दिवो न यस्य विधतो नवीनोद वर्षा रुक्ष ओषधीषु नूनोत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo na yasya vidhato navīnod vṛṣā rukṣa oṣadhīṣu nūnot |
Translation: 7 Like Heaven's when scattering beams his voice was uttered: among the plants the radiant Hero shouted,

Sanskit Text: घर्णा न यो धरजसा पत्मना यन्ना रोदसी वसुनादं सुपत्नी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛṇā na yo dhrajasā patmanā yannā rodasī vasunādaṃ supatnī ||
Translation: Who with his glow in rapid course came hither to fill both worlds, well-wedded Dames, with treasure.

Sanskit Text: धायोभिर्वा यो युज्येभिरर्कैर्विद्युन न दविद्योत सवेभिःशुष्मैह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhāyobhirvā yo yujyebhirarkairvidyun na davidyot svebhiḥśuṣmaih |
Translation: 8 Who, with supporting streams and rays that suit him, hath flashed like lightning with his native vigour.

Sanskit Text: शर्धो वा यो मरुतां ततक्ष रभुर्न तवेषोरभसानो अद्यौत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śardho vā yo marutāṃ tatakṣa ṛbhurna tveṣorabhasāno adyaut ||
Translation: Like the deft Maker of the band of Maruts, the bright impetuous One hath shone refulgent.

Sanskit Text: यथा होतर्मनुषो देवताता यज्ञेभिः सूनो सहसो यजासि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā hotarmanuṣo devatātā yajñebhiḥ sūno sahaso yajāsi |
Translation: 1. As at man's service of the Gods, Invoker, thou, Son of Strength, dost sacrifice and worship,

Sanskit Text: एवा नो अद्य समना समानानुशन्नग्न उशतो यक्षि देवान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā no adya samanā samānānuśannaghna uśato yakṣi devān ||
Translation: So bring for us to-day all Gods together, bring willingly the willing Gods, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: स नो विभावा चक्षणिर्न वस्तोरग्निर्वन्दारु वेद्यश्चनो धात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no vibhāvā cakṣaṇirna vastoraghnirvandāru vedyaścano dhāt |
Translation: 2 May Agni, radiant Herald of the morning, meet to be known, accept our praise with favour.

Sanskit Text: विश्वायुर्यो अम्र्तो मर्त्येषूषर्भुद भूदतिथिर्जातवेदाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāyuryo amṛto martyeṣūṣarbhud bhūdatithirjātavedāḥ ||
Translation: Dear to all life, mid mortal men Immortal, our guest, awake at dawn, is Jātavedas.

Sanskit Text: दयावो न यस्य पनयन्त्यभ्वं भासांसि वस्ते सूर्यो न शुक्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyāvo na yasya panayantyabhvaṃ bhāsāṃsi vaste sūryo na śukraḥ |
Translation: 3 Whose might the very heavens regard with wonder: bright as the Sun he clothes himself with lustre.

Sanskit Text: वि य इनोत्यजरः पावको.अश्नस्य चिच्छिश्नथत पूर्व्याणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi ya inotyajaraḥ pāvako.aśnasya cicchiśnathat pūrvyāṇi ||
Translation: He who sends forth,, Eternal Purifier, hath shattered e’en the ancient works of Aśna.

Sanskit Text: वद्मा हि सूनो अस्यद्मसद्वा चक्रे अग्निर्जनुषाज्मान्नम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vadmā hi sūno asyadmasadvā cakre aghnirjanuṣājmānnam |
Translation: 4 Thou art a Singer, Son! our feast-companion: Agni at birth prepared his food and pathway.

Sanskit Text: स तवं न ऊर्जसन ऊर्जं धा राजेव जेरव्र्के कषेष्यन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvaṃ na ūrjasana ūrjaṃ dhā rājeva jeravṛke kṣeṣyantaḥ ||
Translation: Therefore vouchsafe us strength, O Strength-bestower. Win like a King: foes trouble not thy dwelling.

Sanskit Text: नितिक्ति यो वारणमन्नमत्ति वायुर्न राष्ट्र्यत्येत्यक्तून |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nitikti yo vāraṇamannamatti vāyurna rāṣṭryatyetyaktūn |
Translation: 5 Even he who cats his firm hard food with swiftness,and overtakes the nights as Vāyu kingdoms.

Sanskit Text: तुर्याम यस्त आदिशामरातीरत्यो न हरुतः पततः परिह्रुत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: turyāma yasta ādiśāmarātīratyo na hrutaḥ patataḥ parihrut ||
Translation: May we o’ercome those who resist thine orders, like a steed casting down the flying foemen.

Sanskit Text: आ सूर्यो न भानुमद्भिरर्कैरग्ने ततन्थ रोदसी वि भासा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā sūryo na bhānumadbhirarkairaghne tatantha rodasī vi bhāsā |
Translation: 6 Like Sūrya with his fulgent rays, O Agni, thou overspreadest both the worlds with splendour.

Sanskit Text: चित्रो नयत परि तमांस्यक्तः शोचिषा पत्मन्नौशिजो न दीयन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: citro nayat pari tamāṃsyaktaḥ śociṣā patmannauśijo na dīyan ||
Translation: Decked with bright colour he dispels the darkness, like Auśija, with clear flame swifily flying.

Sanskit Text: तवां हि मन्द्रतममर्कशोकैर्वव्र्महे महि नः शरोष्यग्ने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ hi mandratamamarkaśokairvavṛmahe mahi naḥ śroṣyaghne |
Translation: 7 We have elected thee as most delightful for thy beams' glow: hear our great laud, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं न तवा शवसा देवता वायुं पर्णन्ति राधसान्र्तमाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ na tvā śavasā devatā vāyuṃ pṛṇanti rādhasānṛtamāḥ ||
Translation: The best men praise thee as the peer of Indra in strength, mid Gods, like Viyu in thy bounty.

Sanskit Text: नू नो अग्ने.अव्र्केभिः सवस्ति वेषि रायः पथिभिः पर्ष्यंहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū no aghne.avṛkebhiḥ svasti veṣi rāyaḥ pathibhiḥ parṣyaṃhaḥ |
Translation: 8 Now, Agni, on the tranquil paths of riches come to us for our weal: save us from sorrow.

Sanskit Text: ता सूरिभ्यो गर्णते रासि सुम्नं मदेम शतहिमाःसुवीराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā sūribhyo ghṛṇate rāsi sumnaṃ madema śatahimāḥsuvīrāḥ ||
Translation: Grant chiefs and bard this boon. May we live happy, with hero children, through a hundred winters.

Sanskit Text: हुवे वः सूनुं सहसो युवानमद्रोघवाचं मतिभिर्यविष्ठम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: huve vaḥ sūnuṃ sahaso yuvānamadroghavācaṃ matibhiryaviṣṭham |
Translation: 1. I INVOCATE your Son of Strength, the Youthful, with hymns, the Youngest God, whose speech is guileless;

Sanskit Text: य इन्वति दरविणानि परचेता विश्ववाराणि पुरुवारोध्रुक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya invati draviṇāni pracetā viśvavārāṇi puruvāroadhruk ||
Translation: Sage who sends wealth comprising every treasure, bringer of many boons, devoid of malice.

Sanskit Text: तवे वसूनि पुर्वणीक होतर्दोषा वस्तोरेरिरे यज्ञियासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve vasūni purvaṇīka hotardoṣā vastorerire yajñiyāsaḥ |
Translation: 2 At eve and morn thy pious servants bring thee their precious gifts, O Priest of many aspects,

Sanskit Text: कषामेव विश्वा भुवनानि यस्मिन सं सौभगानि दधिरेपावके ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣāmeva viśvā bhuvanāni yasmin saṃ saubhaghāni dadhirepāvake ||
Translation: On whom, the Purifier, all things living as on firm. ground their happiness have stablished.

Sanskit Text: तवं विक्षु परदिवः सीद आसु करत्वा रथीरभवो वार्याणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ vikṣu pradivaḥ sīda āsu kratvā rathīrabhavo vāryāṇām |
Translation: 3 Thou from of old hast dwelt among these people, by mental power the charioteer of blessings.

Sanskit Text: अत इनोषि विधते चिकित्वो वयानुषग जातवेदो वसूनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ata inoṣi vidhate cikitvo vyānuṣagh jātavedo vasūni ||
Translation: Hence sendest thou, O sapient Jātavedas, to him who serves thee treasures in succession.

Sanskit Text: यो नः सनुत्यो अभिदासदग्ने यो अन्तरो मित्रमहो वनुष्यात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo naḥ sanutyo abhidāsadaghne yo antaro mitramaho vanuṣyāt |
Translation: 4 Agni, whoever secretly attacks us, the neighbour, thou with Mitra's might! who harms us,

Sanskit Text: तमजरेभिर्व्र्षभिस्तव सवैस्तपा तपिष्ठ तपसा तपस्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamajarebhirvṛṣabhistava svaistapā tapiṣṭha tapasā tapasvān ||
Translation: Burn him with thine own Steers for ever youthful, burning with burning heat, thou fiercest burner.

Sanskit Text: यस्ते यज्ञेन समिधा य उक्थैरर्केभिः सूनो सहसो ददाशत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaste yajñena samidhā ya ukthairarkebhiḥ sūno sahaso dadāśat |
Translation: 5 He who serves thee with sacrifice and fuel, with hymn, O Son of Strength, and chanted praises,

Sanskit Text: स मर्त्येष्वम्र्त परचेता राया दयुम्नेन शरवसा वि भाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa martyeṣvamṛta pracetā rāyā dyumnena śravasā vi bhāti ||
Translation: Shines out, Immortal! in the midst of mortals, a sage, with wealth, with splendour and with glory.

Sanskit Text: स तत कर्धीषितस्तूयमग्ने सप्र्धो बाधस्व सहसा सहस्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tat kṛdhīṣitastūyamaghne spṛdho bādhasva sahasā sahasvān |
Translation: 6 Do this, O Agni, when we urge thee, quickly, triumphant in thy might subdue our foemen.

Sanskit Text: यच्छस्यसे दयुभिरक्तो वचोभिस्तज्जुषस्व जरितुर्घोषि मन्म ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yacchasyase dyubhirakto vacobhistajjuṣasva jariturghoṣi manma ||
Translation: When thou art praised with words and decked with brightness, accept this chanted hymn, the singer's worship.

Sanskit Text: अश्याम तं काममग्ने तवोती अश्याम रयिं रयिवः सुवीरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśyāma taṃ kāmamaghne tavotī aśyāma rayiṃ rayivaḥ suvīram |
Translation: 7 Help us, that we may gain this wish, O Agni, gain riches, Wealthy One! with store of heroes.

Sanskit Text: अश्याम वाजमभि वाजयन्तो.अश्याम दयुम्नमजराजरं ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśyāma vājamabhi vājayanto.aśyāma dyumnamajarājaraṃ te ||
Translation: Desiring strength from thee may we be strengthened, and win, Eternal! thine eternal glory.

Sanskit Text: पर नव्यसा सहसः सूनुमछा यज्ञेन गातुमव इछमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra navyasā sahasaḥ sūnumachā yajñena ghātumava ichamānaḥ |
Translation: 1. HE who seeks furtherance and grace to help him goes to the Son of Strength with newest worship,

Sanskit Text: वर्श्चद्वनं कर्ष्णयामं रुशन्तं वीती होतारन्दिव्यं जिगाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛścadvanaṃ kṛṣṇayāmaṃ ruśantaṃ vītī hotārandivyaṃ jighāti ||
Translation: Calling the heavenly Priest to share the banquet, who rends the wood, bright, with his blackened pathway.

Sanskit Text: स शवितानस्तन्यतू रोचनस्था अजरेभिर्नानदद्भिर्यविष्ठः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa śvitānastanyatū rocanasthā ajarebhirnānadadbhiryaviṣṭhaḥ |
Translation: 2 White-hued and thundering he dwells in splendour, Most Youthful, with the loudvoiced and eternal-

Sanskit Text: यः पावकः पुरुतमः पुरूणि पर्थून्यग्निरनुयाति भर्वन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ pāvakaḥ purutamaḥ purūṇi pṛthūnyaghniranuyāti bharvan ||
Translation: Agni, most variform, the Purifier, who follows crunching many ample forests.

Sanskit Text: वि ते विष्वग वातजूतासो अग्ने भामासः शुचे शुचयश्चरन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi te viṣvagh vātajūtāso aghne bhāmāsaḥ śuce śucayaścaranti |
Translation: 3 Incited by the wind thy flames, O Agni, move onward, Pure One! pure, in all directions.

Sanskit Text: तुविम्रक्षासो दिव्या नवग्वा वना वनन्ति धर्षता रुजन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tuvimrakṣāso divyā navaghvā vanā vananti dhṛṣatā rujantaḥ ||
Translation: Thy most destructive heavenly Navagvas break the woods down and devastate them boldly.

Sanskit Text: ये ते शुक्रासः शुचयः शुचिष्मः कषां वपन्ति विषितासो अश्वाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye te śukrāsaḥ śucayaḥ śuciṣmaḥ kṣāṃ vapanti viṣitāso aśvāḥ |
Translation: 4 Thy pure white horses from their bonds are loosened: O Radiant One, they shear the ground beneath them,

Sanskit Text: अध भरमस्त उर्विया वि भाति यातयमानो अधि सानु पर्श्नेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha bhramasta urviyā vi bhāti yātayamāno adhi sānu pṛśneḥ ||
Translation: And far and wide shines out thy flame, and flickers rapidly moving over earth's high ridges.

Sanskit Text: अध जिह्वा पापतीति पर वर्ष्णो गोषुयुधो नाशनिः सर्जाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha jihvā pāpatīti pra vṛṣṇo ghoṣuyudho nāśaniḥ sṛjānā |
Translation: 5 Forth darts the Bull's tongue like the sharp stone weapon discharged by him who fights to win the cattle.

Sanskit Text: शूरस्येव परसितिः कषातिरग्नेर्दुर्वर्तुर्भीमो दयते वनानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śūrasyeva prasitiḥ kṣātiraghnerdurvarturbhīmo dayate vanāni ||
Translation: Agni's fierce flame is like a hero's onset: dread and resistless he destroys the forests.

Sanskit Text: आ भानुना पार्थिवानि जरयांसि महस्तोदस्य धर्षता ततन्थ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā bhānunā pārthivāni jrayāṃsi mahastodasya dhṛṣatā tatantha |
Translation: 6 Thou with the sunlight of the great Impeller hast boldly over-spread the earth's expanses.

Sanskit Text: स बाधस्वाप भया सहोभि सप्र्धो वनुष्यन वनुषो नि जूर्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa bādhasvāpa bhayā sahobhi spṛdho vanuṣyan vanuṣo ni jūrva ||
Translation: So drive away with conquering might all perils. fighting out foemen burn up those who harm us.

Sanskit Text: स चित्र चित्रं चितयन्तमस्मे चित्रक्षत्र चित्रतमं वयोधाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa citra citraṃ citayantamasme citrakṣatra citratamaṃ vayodhām |
Translation: 7 Wondrous! of wondrous power! give to the singer wealth wondrous, marked, most wonderful, life-giving.

Sanskit Text: चन्द्रं रयिं पुरुवीरं बर्हन्तं चन्द्र चन्द्राभिर्ग्र्णते युवस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: candraṃ rayiṃ puruvīraṃ bṛhantaṃ candra candrābhirghṛṇate yuvasva ||
Translation: Wealth bright, O Bright One, vast, with many heroes, give with thy bright flames to the man who lauds thee.

Sanskit Text: मूर्धानं दिवो अरतिं पर्थिव्या वैश्वानरं रत आ जातमग्निम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mūrdhānaṃ divo aratiṃ pṛthivyā vaiśvānaraṃ ṛta ā jātamaghnim |
Translation: 1. Him, messenger of earth and head of heaven, Agni Vaiśvānara, born in holy Order,

Sanskit Text: कविं सम्राजमतिथिं जनानामासन्ना पात्रं जनयन्त देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaviṃ samrājamatithiṃ janānāmāsannā pātraṃ janayanta devāḥ ||
Translation: The Sage, the King, the guest of men, a vessel fit for their mouths, the Gods have generated.

Sanskit Text: नाभिं यज्ञानां सदनं रयीणां महामाहावमभिसं नवन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nābhiṃ yajñānāṃ sadanaṃ rayīṇāṃ mahāmāhāvamabhisaṃ navanta |
Translation: 2 Him have they praised, mid-point of sacrifices, great cistern of libations, seat of riches.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानरं रथ्यमध्वराणां यज्ञस्य केतुं जनयन्त देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānaraṃ rathyamadhvarāṇāṃ yajñasya ketuṃ janayanta devāḥ ||
Translation: Vaiśvānara, conveyer of oblations, ensign of worship, have the Gods engendered.

Sanskit Text: तवद विप्रो जायते वाज्यग्ने तवद वीरासो अभिमातिषाहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvad vipro jāyate vājyaghne tvad vīrāso abhimātiṣāhaḥ |
Translation: 3 From thee, O Agni, springs the mighty singer, from thee come heroes who subdue the foeman.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानर तवमस्मासु धेहि वसूनि राजन सप्र्हयाय्याणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānara tvamasmāsu dhehi vasūni rājan spṛhayāyyāṇi ||
Translation: O King, Vaiśvānara, bestow thou on us excellent treasures worthy to belonged fo r.

Sanskit Text: तवां विश्वे अम्र्त जायमानं शिशुं न देवा अभि सं नवन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ viśve amṛta jāyamānaṃ śiśuṃ na devā abhi saṃ navante |
Translation: 4 To thee, Immortal! when to life thou springest, all the Gods sing for joy as to their infant.

Sanskit Text: तव करतुभिरम्र्तत्वमायन वैश्वानर यत पित्रोरदीदेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava kratubhiramṛtatvamāyan vaiśvānara yat pitroradīdeḥ ||
Translation: They by thy mental powers were made immortal, Vaiśvānara, when thou shonest from thy Parents.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानर तव तानि वरतानि महान्यग्ने नकिरा दधर्ष |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānara tava tāni vratāni mahānyaghne nakirā dadharṣa |
Translation: 5 Agni Vaiśvānara, no one hath ever resisted these thy mighty ordinances,

Sanskit Text: यज्जायमानः पित्रोरुपस्थे.अविन्दः केतुं वयुनेष्वह्नाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajjāyamānaḥ pitrorupasthe.avindaḥ ketuṃ vayuneṣvahnām ||
Translation: When thou, arising from thy Parents' bosom, foundest the light for days' appointed courses.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानरस्य विमितानि चक्षसा सानूनि दिवो अम्र्तस्य केतुना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānarasya vimitāni cakṣasā sānūni divo amṛtasya ketunā |
Translation: 6 The summits of the heaven are traversed through and through by the Immortal's light, Vaiśvānara's brilliancy.

Sanskit Text: तस्येदु विश्वा भुवनाधि मूर्धनि वया इव रुरुहुःसप्त विस्रुहः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasyedu viśvā bhuvanādhi mūrdhani vayā iva ruruhuḥsapta visruhaḥ ||
Translation: All creatures in existence rest upon his head. The Seven swift-flowing Streams have grown like branches forth,

Sanskit Text: वि यो रजांस्यमिमीत सुक्रतुर्वैश्वानरो वि दिवो रोचना कविः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yo rajāṃsyamimīta sukraturvaiśvānaro vi divo rocanā kaviḥ |
Translation: 7 Vaiśvānara, who measured out the realms of air, Sage very wise who made the lucid spheres of heaven,

Sanskit Text: परि यो विश्वा भुवनानि पप्रथे.अदब्धो गोपा अम्र्तस्य रक्षिता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari yo viśvā bhuvanāni paprathe.adabdho ghopā amṛtasya rakṣitā ||
Translation: The Undeceivable who spread out all the worlds, keeper is he and guard of immortality.

Sanskit Text: अहश्च कर्ष्णमहरर्जुनं च वि वर्तेते रजसी वेद्याभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaśca kṛṣṇamahararjunaṃ ca vi vartete rajasī vedyābhiḥ |
Translation: 1. ONE half of day is dark, and bright the other: both atmospheres move on by sage devices.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानरो जायमानो न राजावातिरज्ज्योतिषाग्निस्तमांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānaro jāyamāno na rājāvātirajjyotiṣāghnistamāṃsi ||
Translation: Agni Vaiśvānara, when born as Sovran, hath with his lustre overcome the darkness.

Sanskit Text: नाहं तन्तुं न वि जानाम्योतुं न यं वयन्ति समरेऽतमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāhaṃ tantuṃ na vi jānāmyotuṃ na yaṃ vayanti samare'tamānāḥ |
Translation: 2 I know not either warp or woof, I know not the web they weave when moving to the contest.

Sanskit Text: कस्य सवित पुत्र इह वक्त्वानि परो वदात्यवरेण पित्रा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kasya svit putra iha vaktvāni paro vadātyavareṇa pitrā ||
Translation: Whose son shall here speak words that must be spoken without assistance from the Father near him?

Sanskit Text: स इत तन्तुं स वि जानात्योतुं स वक्त्वान्य रतुथा वदाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa it tantuṃ sa vi jānātyotuṃ sa vaktvāny ṛtuthā vadāti |
Translation: 3 For both the warp and woof he understandeth, and in due time shall speak what should be spoken,

Sanskit Text: य ईं चिकेतदम्र्तस्य गोपा अवश्चरन परो अन्येन पश्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya īṃ ciketadamṛtasya ghopā avaścaran paro anyena paśyan ||
Translation: Who knoweth as the immortal world's Protector, descending, seeing with no aid from other.

Sanskit Text: अयं होता परथमः पश्यतेममिदं जयोतिरम्र्तं मर्त्येषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ hotā prathamaḥ paśyatemamidaṃ jyotiramṛtaṃ martyeṣu |
Translation: 4 He is the Priest, the first of all: behold him. Mid mortal men he is the light immortal.

Sanskit Text: अयं स जज्ञे धरुव आ निषत्तो.अमर्त्यस्तन्वा वर्धमानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ sa jajñe dhruva ā niṣatto.amartyastanvā vardhamānaḥ ||
Translation: Here was he born, firm-seated in his station Immortal, ever waxing in his body.

Sanskit Text: धरुवं जयोतिर्निहितं दर्शये कं मनो जविष्ठं पतयत्स्वन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhruvaṃ jyotirnihitaṃ dṛśaye kaṃ mano javiṣṭhaṃ patayatsvantaḥ |
Translation: 5 A firm light hath been set for men to look on: among all things that fly the mind is swiftest.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवाः समनसः सकेता एकं करतुमभिवि यन्ति साधु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devāḥ samanasaḥ saketā ekaṃ kratumabhivi yanti sādhu ||
Translation: All Gods of one accord, with one intention, move unobstructed to a single purpose.

Sanskit Text: वि मे कर्णा पतयतो वि चक्षुर्वीदं जयोतिर्ह्र्दय आहितं यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi me karṇā patayato vi cakṣurvīdaṃ jyotirhṛdaya āhitaṃ yat |
Translation: 6 Mine ears unclose to hear, mine eye to see him; the light that harbours in my spirit broadens.

Sanskit Text: वि मे मनश्चरति दूराधीः किं सविद वक्ष्यामिकिमु नू मनिष्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi me manaścarati dūraādhīḥ kiṃ svid vakṣyāmikimu nū maniṣye ||
Translation: Far roams my mind whose thoughts are in the distance. What shall I speak, what shall I now imagine?

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवा अनमस्यन भियानास्त्वामग्ने तमसि तस्थिवांसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devā anamasyan bhiyānāstvāmaghne tamasi tasthivāṃsam |
Translation: 7 All the Gods bowed them down in fear before thee, Agni, when thou wast dwelling in the darkness.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानरो.अवतूतये नो.अमर्त्यो.अवतूतये नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānaro.avatūtaye no.amartyo.avatūtaye naḥ ||
Translation: Vaiśvānara be gracious to assist us, may the Immortal favour us and help us.

Sanskit Text: पुरो वो मन्द्रं दिव्यं सुव्र्क्तिं परयति यज्ञे अग्निमध्वरेदधिध्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: puro vo mandraṃ divyaṃ suvṛktiṃ prayati yajñe aghnimadhvaredadhidhvam |
Translation: 1. INSTALL at sacrifice, while the rite advances, your pleasant, heavenly Agni, meet for praises.

Sanskit Text: पुर उक्थेभिः स हि नो विभावा सवध्वरा करति जातवेदाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pura ukthebhiḥ sa hi no vibhāvā svadhvarā karati jātavedāḥ ||
Translation: With hymns-for he illumines us-install him. He, Jātavedas, makes our rites successful.

Sanskit Text: तमु दयुमः पुर्वणीक होतरग्ने अग्निभिर्मनुष इधानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamu dyumaḥ purvaṇīka hotaraghne aghnibhirmanuṣa idhānaḥ |
Translation: 2 Hear this laud, Radiant Priest of many aspects, O Agni with the fires of man enkindled,

Sanskit Text: सतोमं यमस्मै ममतेव शूषं घर्तं न शुचि मतयः पवन्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stomaṃ yamasmai mamateva śūṣaṃ ghṛtaṃ na śuci matayaḥ pavante ||
Translation: Laud which bards send forth pure as sacred butter, strength to this man, as ’twere for self-advantage.

Sanskit Text: पीपाय स शरवसा मर्त्येषु यो अग्नये ददाश विप्र उक्थैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pīpāya sa śravasā martyeṣu yo aghnaye dadāśa vipra ukthaiḥ |
Translation: 3 Mid mortal men that singer thrives in glory who offers gifts with hymns of praise to Agni,

Sanskit Text: चित्राभिस्तमूतिभिश्चित्रशोचिर्व्रजस्य साता गोमतो दधाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: citrābhistamūtibhiścitraśocirvrajasya sātā ghomato dadhāti ||
Translation: And the God, wondrous bright, with wondrous succours helps him to win a stable filled with cattle.

Sanskit Text: आ यः पप्रौ जायमान उर्वी दूरेद्र्शा भासा कर्ष्णाध्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yaḥ paprau jāyamāna urvī dūredṛśā bhāsā kṛṣṇādhvā |
Translation: 4 He, at his birth, whose path is black behind him, filled heaven and earth with far-apparent splendour:

Sanskit Text: अध बहु चित तम ऊर्म्यायास्तिरः शोचिषा दद्र्शे पावकः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha bahu cit tama ūrmyāyāstiraḥ śociṣā dadṛśe pāvakaḥ ||
Translation: And he himself hath been. through night's thick darkness, made manifest by light, the Purifier.

Sanskit Text: नू नश्चित्रं पुरुवाजाभिरूती अग्ने रयिं मघवद्भ्यश्च धेहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū naścitraṃ puruvājābhirūtī aghne rayiṃ maghavadbhyaśca dhehi |
Translation: 5 With thy most mighty aid, confer, O Agni, wonderful wealth on us and on our princes,

Sanskit Text: ये राधसा शरवसा चात्यन्यान सुवीर्येभिश्चाभि सन्ति जनान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye rādhasā śravasā cātyanyān suvīryebhiścābhi santi janān ||
Translation: Who stand preeminent, surpassing others in liberal gifts, in fame, and hero virtues.

Sanskit Text: इमं यज्ञं चनो धा अग्न उशन यं त आसानो जुहुते हविष्मान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ yajñaṃ cano dhā aghna uśan yaṃ ta āsāno juhute haviṣmān |
Translation: 6 Agni, accept this sacrifice with gladness, which, seated here, the worshipper presenteth.

Sanskit Text: भरद्वाजेषु दधिषे सुव्र्क्तिमवीर्वाजस्य गध्यस्य सातौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharadvājeṣu dadhiṣe suvṛktimavīrvājasya ghadhyasya sātau ||
Translation: Fair hymns hadst thou among the Bharadvājas, and holpest them to gain abundant vigour.

Sanskit Text: वि दवेषांसीनुहि वर्धयेळां मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi dveṣāṃsīnuhi vardhayeḷāṃ madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ ||
Translation: 7 Scatter our foes, increase our store. May we he glad a hundred winters with brave sons.

Sanskit Text: मध्ये होता दुरोणे बर्हिषो राळ अग्निस्तोदस्य रोदसी यजध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhye hotā duroṇe barhiṣo rāḷ aghnistodasya rodasī yajadhyai |
Translation: 1. KING of trimmed grass, Herald within the dwelling, may Agni worship the Impeller's World-halves.

Sanskit Text: अयं स सूनुः सहस रतावा दूरात सूर्यो न शोचिषा ततान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ sa sūnuḥ sahasa ṛtāvā dūrāt sūryo na śociṣā tatāna ||
Translation: He, Son of Strength, the Holy, from a distance hath spread himself abroad with light like Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: आ यस्मिन तवे सवपाके यजत्र यक्षद राजन सर्वतातेव नुद्यौः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yasmin tve svapāke yajatra yakṣad rājan sarvatāteva nudyauḥ |
Translation: 2 In thee, most wise, shall Dyaus, for full perfection, King! Holy One! pronounce the call to worship.

Sanskit Text: तरिषधस्थस्ततरुषो न जंहो हव्या मघानि मानुषा यजध्यै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: triṣadhasthastataruṣo na jaṃho havyā maghāni mānuṣā yajadhyai ||
Translation: Found in three places, like the Speeder's footstep, come to present men's riches as oblations!

Sanskit Text: तेजिष्ठा यस्यारतिर्वनेराट तोदो अध्वन न वर्धसानो अद्यौत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tejiṣṭhā yasyāratirvanerāṭ todo adhvan na vṛdhasāno adyaut |
Translation: 3 Whose blaze most splendid, sovran in the forest, shines waxing on his way like the - Impeller.

Sanskit Text: अद्रोघो न दरविता चेतति तमन्नमर्त्यो.अवर्त्र ओषधीषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adrogho na dravitā cetati tmannamartyo.avartra oṣadhīṣu ||
Translation: He knows himself, like as a guileless smelter, not to be stayed among the plants, Immortal.

Sanskit Text: सास्माकेभिरेतरी न शूषैरग्नि षटवे दम आ जातवेदाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sāsmākebhiretarī na śūṣairaghni ṣṭave dama ā jātavedāḥ |
Translation: 4 Our friends extol him like a steed for vigour even Agni in the dwelling, jatave~as.

Sanskit Text: दर्वन्नो वन्वन करत्वा नार्वोस्रः पितेव जारयायि यज्ञैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: drvanno vanvan kratvā nārvosraḥ piteva jārayāyi yajñaiḥ ||
Translation: Trce-fed, he fights with power as doth a champion, like Dawn's Sire to be praised with sacrifices.

Sanskit Text: अध समास्य पनयन्ति भासो वर्था यत तक्षदनुयाति पर्थ्वीम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha smāsya panayanti bhāso vṛthā yat takṣadanuyāti pṛthvīm |
Translation: 5 Men wonder at his shining glows when, paring the woods with case, o’er the broad earth he goeth,

Sanskit Text: सद्यो यः सयन्द्रो विषितो धवीयान रणो न तायुरति धन्वा राट ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadyo yaḥ syandro viṣito dhavīyān ṛṇo na tāyurati dhanvā rāṭ ||
Translation: And, like a rushing flood, loosed quickly, burneth, swift as a guilty thief, o’er desert places.

Sanskit Text: स तवं नो अर्वन निदाया विश्वेभिरग्ने अग्निभिरिधानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvaṃ no arvan nidāyā viśvebhiraghne aghnibhiridhānaḥ |
Translation: 6 So mighty thou protectest us from slander, O Champion, Agni! with all fires enkindled.

Sanskit Text: वेषि रायो वि यासि दुछुना मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: veṣi rāyo vi yāsi duchunā madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ ||
Translation: Bring opulence and drive away affliction. May brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

Sanskit Text: तवद विश्वा सुभग सौभगान्यग्ने वि यन्ति वनिनो न वयाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvad viśvā subhagha saubhaghānyaghne vi yanti vanino na vayāḥ |
Translation: 1. FROM thee, as branches from a tree, O Agni, from thee, Auspicious God! spring all our blessings-

Sanskit Text: शरुष्टी रयिर्वाजो वर्त्रतूर्ये दिवो वर्ष्टिरीड्यो रीतिरपाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śruṣṭī rayirvājo vṛtratūrye divo vṛṣṭirīḍyo rītirapām ||
Translation: Wealth swiftly, strength in battle with our foemen, the rain besought of heaven, the flow of waters.

Sanskit Text: तवं भगो न आ हि रत्नमिषे परिज्मेव कषयसि दस्मवर्चाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ bhagho na ā hi ratnamiṣe parijmeva kṣayasi dasmavarcāḥ |
Translation: 2 Thou art our Bhaga to send wealth thou dwellest, like circumambient air, with wondrous splendour.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने मित्रो न बर्हत रतस्यासि कषत्ता वामस्य देव भूरेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne mitro na bṛhata ṛtasyāsi kṣattā vāmasya deva bhūreḥ ||
Translation: Friend art thou of the lofty Law, like Mitra, Controller, Agni! God! of many a blessing.

Sanskit Text: स सत्पतिः शवसा हन्ति वर्त्रमग्ने विप्रो वि पणेर्भर्तिवाजम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa satpatiḥ śavasā hanti vṛtramaghne vipro vi paṇerbhartivājam |
Translation: 3 Agni! the hero slays with might his foeman; the singer bears away the Paṇi's booty-

Sanskit Text: यं तवं परचेत रतजात राया सजोषा नप्त्रापां हिनोषि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ tvaṃ praceta ṛtajāta rāyā sajoṣā naptrāpāṃ hinoṣi ||
Translation: Even he whom thou, Sage, born in Law, incitest by wealth, accordant with the Child of Waters.

Sanskit Text: यस्ते सूनो सहसो गीर्भिरुक्थैर्यज्ञैर्मर्तो निशितिं वेद्यानट |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaste sūno sahaso ghīrbhirukthairyajñairmarto niśitiṃ vedyānaṭ |
Translation: 4 The man who, Son of Strength 1 with sacrifices, hymns, lauds, attracts thy fervour to the altar,

Sanskit Text: विश्वं स देव परति वारमग्ने धत्ते धान्यं पत्यते वसव्यैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvaṃ sa deva prati vāramaghne dhatte dhānyaṃ patyate vasavyaiḥ ||
Translation: Enjoys each precious thing, O God, O Agni, gains wealth of corn and is the lord of treasures.

Sanskit Text: ता नर्भ्य आ सौश्रवसा सुवीराग्ने सूनो सहसः पुष्यसेधाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā nṛbhya ā sauśravasā suvīrāghne sūno sahasaḥ puṣyasedhāḥ |
Translation: 5 Grant, Son of Strength, to men for their subsistence such things as bring high fame and hero children.

Sanskit Text: कर्णोषि यच्छवसा भूरि पश्वो वयो वर्कायारयेजसुरये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṇoṣi yacchavasā bhūri paśvo vayo vṛkāyārayejasuraye ||
Translation: For thou with might givest much food in cattle even to the wicked wolf when he is hungry.

Sanskit Text: वद्मा सूनो सहसो नो विहाया अग्ने तोकं तनयं वाजि नो दाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vadmā sūno sahaso no vihāyā aghne tokaṃ tanayaṃ vāji no dāḥ |
Translation: 6 Eloquent, Son of Strength, Most Mighty, Agni, vouchsafe us seed and offspring, full of vigour.

Sanskit Text: विश्वाभिर्गीर्भिरभि पूर्तिमश्यां मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvābhirghīrbhirabhi pūrtimaśyāṃ madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ ||
Translation: May I by all my songs obtain abundance. May brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

Sanskit Text: इममू षु वो अतिथिमुषर्बुधं विश्वासां विशां पतिम्र्ञ्जसे गिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imamū ṣu vo atithimuṣarbudhaṃ viśvāsāṃ viśāṃ patimṛñjase ghirā |
Translation: 1. WITH this my song I strive to reach this guest of yours, who wakes at early morn, the Lord of all the tribes.

Sanskit Text: वेतीद दिवो जनुषा कच्चिदा शुचिर्ज्योक चिदत्ति गर्भो यदच्युतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vetīd divo januṣā kaccidā śucirjyok cidatti gharbho yadacyutam ||
Translation: Each time he comes from heaven, the Pure One from of old: from ancient days the Child cats everlasting food.

Sanskit Text: मित्रं न यं सुधितं भर्गवो दधुर्वनस्पतावीड्यमूर्ध्वशोचिषम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitraṃ na yaṃ sudhitaṃ bhṛghavo dadhurvanaspatāvīḍyamūrdhvaśociṣam |
Translation: 2 Whom, well-dis sed, the Blirgus stablished as a rriend, whom men must glorify, high-flaming in the wood.

Sanskit Text: स तवं सुप्रीतो वीतहव्ये अद्भुत परशस्तिभिर्महयसे दिवे दिवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvaṃ suprīto vītahavye adbhuta praśastibhirmahayase dive dive ||
Translation: As such, most friendly, thou art every day extolled in lauds by Vitahavya, O thou wondrous God.

Sanskit Text: स तवं दक्षस्याव्र्को वर्धो भूरर्यः परस्यान्तरस्य तरुषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvaṃ dakṣasyāvṛko vṛdho bhūraryaḥ parasyāntarasya taruṣaḥ |
Translation: 3 Be thou the foeless helper of the skilful man, subduer of the enemy near or far away.

Sanskit Text: रायः सूनो सहसो मर्त्येष्वा छर्दिर्यछ वीतहव्याय सप्रथो भरद्वाजाय सप्रथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyaḥ sūno sahaso martyeṣvā chardiryacha vītahavyāya sapratho bharadvājāya saprathaḥ ||
Translation: Bestow a wealthy home on men, O Son of Strength. Give Vitahavya riches spreading far and wide, give Bharadvāja wide-spread wealth.

Sanskit Text: दयुतानं वो अतिथिं सवर्णरमग्निं होतारं मनुषः सवध्वरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyutānaṃ vo atithiṃ svarṇaramaghniṃ hotāraṃ manuṣaḥ svadhvaram |
Translation: 4 Him, your refulgent guest, Agni who comes from heaven, the Herald of mankind, well-skilled in sacred rites,

Sanskit Text: विप्रं न दयुक्षवचसं सुव्र्क्तिभिर्हव्यवाहमरतिं देवं रञ्जसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vipraṃ na dyukṣavacasaṃ suvṛktibhirhavyavāhamaratiṃ devaṃ ṛñjase ||
Translation: Who, like a holy singer, utters heavenly words, oblation-bearer, envoy, God, I seek with hymns.

Sanskit Text: पावकया यश्चितयन्त्या कर्पा कषामन रुरुच उषसो न भानुना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāvakayā yaścitayantyā kṛpā kṣāman ruruca uṣaso na bhānunā |
Translation: 5 Who with his purifying, eye-attracting form hath shone upon the earth as with the light of Dawn;

Sanskit Text: तूर्वन न यामन्नेतशस्य नू रण आ यो घर्णे न तत्र्षाणो अजरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tūrvan na yāmannetaśasya nū raṇa ā yo ghṛṇe na tatṛṣāṇo ajaraḥ ||
Translation: Who speeding on, as in the fight of Etaia, cometh, untouched by age, as one athirst in heat.

Sanskit Text: अग्निम-अग्निं वः समिधा दुवस्यत परियम-परियं वो अतिथिं गर्णीषणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnim-aghniṃ vaḥ samidhā duvasyata priyam-priyaṃ vo atithiṃ ghṛṇīṣaṇi |
Translation: 6 Worship ye Agni, Agni, with your log of wood; praise your beloved, your beloved guest with songs.

Sanskit Text: उप वो गीर्भिरम्र्तं विवासत देवो देवेषु वनते हि वार्यं देवो देवेषु वनते हि नो दुवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa vo ghīrbhiramṛtaṃ vivāsata devo deveṣu vanate hi vāryaṃ devo deveṣu vanate hi no duvaḥ ||
Translation: Invite ye the Immortal hither with your hymns. A God among the Gods, he loveth what is choice, loveth our service, God mid Gods.

Sanskit Text: समिद्धमग्निं समिधा गिरा गर्णे शुचिं पावकं पुरो अध्वरे धरुवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samiddhamaghniṃ samidhā ghirā ghṛṇe śuciṃ pāvakaṃ puro adhvare dhruvam |
Translation: 7 Agni inflamed with fuel in my song I sing, pure, Cleanser, steadlast, set in tront at sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: विप्रं होतारं पुरुवारमद्रुहं कविं सुम्नैरीमहे जातवेदसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vipraṃ hotāraṃ puruvāramadruhaṃ kaviṃ sumnairīmahe jātavedasam ||
Translation: Wise Jātavedas we implore with prayers for bliss the Priest, the holy Singer, bounteous, void of guile.

Sanskit Text: तवां दूतमग्ने अम्र्तं युगे-युगे हव्यवाहं दधिरे पायुमीड्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ dūtamaghne amṛtaṃ yughe-yughe havyavāhaṃ dadhire pāyumīḍyam |
Translation: 8 Men, Agni, in each age have made thee, Deathiess One, their envoy, offering-bearer, guard adorable.

Sanskit Text: देवासश्च मर्तासश्च जाग्र्विं विभुं विश्पतिं नमसा नि षेदिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāsaśca martāsaśca jāghṛviṃ vibhuṃ viśpatiṃ namasā ni ṣedire ||
Translation: With reverence Gods and mortals have established thee, the ever-watchful, omnipresent Household Lord.

Sanskit Text: विभूषन्नग्न उभयाननु वरता दूतो देवानां रजसी समीयसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vibhūṣannaghna ubhayānanu vratā dūto devānāṃ rajasī samīyase |
Translation: 9 Thou, Agni, ordering the works and ways of both, as envoy of the Gods traversest both the worlds.

Sanskit Text: यत ते धीतिं सुमतिमाव्र्णीमहे.अध समा नस्त्रिवरूथः शिवो भव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te dhītiṃ sumatimāvṛṇīmahe.adha smā nastrivarūthaḥ śivo bhava ||
Translation: When we lay claim to thy regard and gracious fare, be thou to us a thriceprotecting friendly guard.

Sanskit Text: तं सुप्रतीकं सुद्र्शं सवञ्चमविद्वांसो विदुष्टरं सपेम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ supratīkaṃ sudṛśaṃ svañcamavidvāṃso viduṣṭaraṃ sapema |
Translation: 10 Him fair of face, rapid, and fair to look on, him very wise may we who know not follow.

Sanskit Text: स यक्षद विश्वा वयुनानि विद्वान पर हव्यमग्निरम्र्तेषु वोचत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa yakṣad viśvā vayunāni vidvān pra havyamaghniramṛteṣu vocat ||
Translation: Let him who knows all rules invite for worship, Agru announce our offering to the Immortals.

Sanskit Text: तमग्ने पास्युत तं पिपर्षि यस्त आनट कवये शूर धीतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamaghne pāsyuta taṃ piparṣi yasta ānaṭ kavaye śūra dhītim |
Translation: 11 Him, Agni, thou deliverest and savest who brings him prayer to thee the Wise, O Hero,

Sanskit Text: यज्ञस्य वा निशितिं वोदितिं वा तमित पर्णक्षि शवसोत राया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñasya vā niśitiṃ voditiṃ vā tamit pṛṇakṣi śavasota rāyā ||
Translation: The end of sacrifice or its inception; yea, thou endowest him with power and riches.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने वनुष्यतो नि पाहि तवमु नः सहसावन्नवद्यात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne vanuṣyato ni pāhi tvamu naḥ sahasāvannavadyāt |
Translation: 12 Guard us from him who would assail us, Agni; preserve us, O thou Victor, from dishonour.

Sanskit Text: सं तवा धवस्मन्वदभ्येतु पाथः सं रयि सप्र्हयाय्यःसहस्री ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ tvā dhvasmanvadabhyetu pāthaḥ saṃ rayi spṛhayāyyaḥsahasrī ||
Translation: Here let the place of darkening come upon thee: may wealth be ours, desirable in thousands.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्होता गर्हपतिः स राजा विश्वा वेद जनिमा जातवेदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirhotā ghṛhapatiḥ sa rājā viśvā veda janimā jātavedaḥ |
Translation: 13 Agni, the Priest, is King, Lord of the homestead, he, Jatayedas, knows all generations.

Sanskit Text: देवानामुत यो मर्त्यानां यजिष्ठः स पर यजतां रतावा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānāmuta yo martyānāṃ yajiṣṭhaḥ sa pra yajatāṃ ṛtāvā ||
Translation: Most skilful worshipper mid Gods and mortals, may he begin the sacrifice, the Holy.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने यदद्य विशो अध्वरस्य होतः पावकशोचे वेष टवं हि यज्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne yadadya viśo adhvarasya hotaḥ pāvakaśoce veṣ ṭvaṃ hi yajvā |
Translation: 14 Whate’er to-day thou, bright-flamed Priest, enjoyest from the man's rite-for thou art sacrificer-

Sanskit Text: रता यजासि महिना वि यद भूर्हव्या वह यविष्ठ या ते अद्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtā yajāsi mahinā vi yad bhūrhavyā vaha yaviṣṭha yā te adya ||
Translation: Worship, for duly dost thou spread in greatness: bear off thine ofrerings of to-day, Most Youthful.

Sanskit Text: अभि परयांसि सुधितानि हि खयो नि तवा दधीत रोदसी यजध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi prayāṃsi sudhitāni hi khyo ni tvā dadhīta rodasī yajadhyai |
Translation: 15 Look thou upon the viands duly laid for thee. Fain would he set thee here to worship Heaven and,Earth.

Sanskit Text: अवा नो मघवन वाजसातावग्ने विश्वानि दुरिता तरेम ता तरेम तवावसा तरेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avā no maghavan vājasātāvaghne viśvāni duritā tarema tā tarema tavāvasā tarema ||
Translation: Help us, O liberal Agni, in the strife for spoil, so that we may o’ercome all things that trouble us, o’ercome, o’ercome them with thy help.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने विश्वेभिः सवनीक देवैरूर्णावन्तं परथमः सीद योनिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne viśvebhiḥ svanīka devairūrṇāvantaṃ prathamaḥ sīda yonim |
Translation: 16 Together with all Gods, O fair-faced Agni, be seated first upon the woollined altar,

Sanskit Text: कुलायिनं घर्तवन्तं सवित्रे यज्ञं नय यजमानाय साधु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kulāyinaṃ ghṛtavantaṃ savitre yajñaṃ naya yajamānāya sādhu ||
Translation: Nest-like, bedewed with oil. Bear this our worship to Savitar who sacrifices rightly.

Sanskit Text: इममु तयमथर्ववदग्निं मन्थन्ति वेधसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imamu tyamatharvavadaghniṃ manthanti vedhasaḥ |
Translation: 17 Here the arranging priests, as did Atharvan, rub this Agni forth,

Sanskit Text: यमङकूयन्तमानयन्नमूरं शयाव्याभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamaṅkūyantamānayannamūraṃ śyāvyābhyaḥ ||
Translation: Whom, not bewildered, as he moved in winding ways, they brought from gloom.

Sanskit Text: जनिष्वा देववीतये सर्वताता सवस्तये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: janiṣvā devavītaye sarvatātā svastaye |
Translation: 18 For the Gods’ banquet be thou born, for full perfection and for weal.

Sanskit Text: आ देवान वक्ष्यम्र्तान रताव्र्धो यज्ञं देवेषु पिस्प्र्शः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā devān vakṣyamṛtān ṛtāvṛdho yajñaṃ deveṣu pispṛśaḥ ||
Translation: Bring the Immortal Gods who strengthen holy Law: so let our sacrifice reach the Gods.

Sanskit Text: वयमु तवा गर्हपते जनानामग्ने अकर्म समिधा बर्हन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayamu tvā ghṛhapate janānāmaghne akarma samidhā bṛhantam |
Translation: 19 O Agni, Lord and Master of men's homesteads, with kindled fuel we have made thee mighty.

Sanskit Text: अस्थूरि नो गार्हपत्यानि सन्तु तिग्मेन नस्तेजसा सं शिशाधि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asthūri no ghārhapatyāni santu tighmena nastejasā saṃ śiśādhi ||
Translation: Let not our household gear be found defective. Sharpen us with thy penetrating splendour.

Sanskit Text: पिबा सोममभि यमुग्र तर्द ऊर्वं गव्यं महि गर्णानैन्द्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibā somamabhi yamughra tarda ūrvaṃ ghavyaṃ mahi ghṛṇānaindra |
Translation: 1. DRINK Soma, Mighty One, for which, when lauded, thou breakest through the cattle-stall, O Indra;

Sanskit Text: वि यो धर्ष्णो वधिषो वज्रहस्त विश्वा वर्त्रममित्रिया शवोभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yo dhṛṣṇo vadhiṣo vajrahasta viśvā vṛtramamitriyā śavobhiḥ ||
Translation: Thou who, O Bold One, armed with thunder smotest Vṛtra with might, and every hostile being.

Sanskit Text: स ईं पाहि य रजीषी तरुत्रो यः शिप्रवान वर्षभो यो मतीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa īṃ pāhi ya ṛjīṣī tarutro yaḥ śipravān vṛṣabho yo matīnām |
Translation: 2 Drink it thou God who art impetuous victor, Lord of our hymns, with beauteousjaws, the Hero,

Sanskit Text: यो गोत्रभिद वज्रभ्र्द यो हरिष्ठाः स इन्द्र चित्रानभि तर्न्धि वाजान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo ghotrabhid vajrabhṛd yo hariṣṭhāḥ sa indra citrānabhi tṛndhi vājān ||
Translation: Render of kine-stalls, car-borne, thunder-wielding, so pierce thy way to wondrous strength, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: एवा पाहि परत्नथा मन्दतु तवा शरुधि बरह्म वाव्र्धस्वोतगीर्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā pāhi pratnathā mandatu tvā śrudhi brahma vāvṛdhasvotaghīrbhiḥ |
Translation: 3 Drink as of old, and let the draught delight thee. hear thou our prayer and let our songs exalt thee.

Sanskit Text: आविः सूर्यं कर्णुहि पीपिहीषो जहि शत्रून्रभि गा इन्द्र तर्न्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āviḥ sūryaṃ kṛṇuhi pīpihīṣo jahi śatrūnrabhi ghā indra tṛndhi ||
Translation: Make the Sun visible, make food abundant, slaughter the foes, pierce through and free the cattle.

Sanskit Text: ते तवा मदा बर्हदिन्द्र सवधाव इमे पीता उक्षयन्त दयुमन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te tvā madā bṛhadindra svadhāva ime pītā ukṣayanta dyumantam |
Translation: 4 These gladdening drops, O Indra, Self-sustainer, quaffed shall augment thee in thy mighty splendour.

Sanskit Text: महामनूनं तवसं विभूतिं मत्सरासो जर्ह्र्षन्त परसाहम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahāmanūnaṃ tavasaṃ vibhūtiṃ matsarāso jarhṛṣanta prasāham ||
Translation: Yea, let the cheering drops delight thee greatly, great, perfect, strong, powerful, all-subduing.

Sanskit Text: येभिः सूर्यमुषसं मन्दसानो.अवासयो.अप दर्ल्हानि दर्द्रत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yebhiḥ sūryamuṣasaṃ mandasāno.avāsayo.apa dṛlhāni dardrat |
Translation: 5 Gladdened whereby, bursting the firm enclosures, thou gavest splendour to the Sun and Morning.

Sanskit Text: महामद्रिं परि गा इन्द्र सन्तं नुत्था अच्युतं सदसस परि सवात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahāmadriṃ pari ghā indra santaṃ nutthā acyutaṃ sadasas pari svāt ||
Translation: The mighty rock that compassed in the cattle, ne’er moved, thou shookest from its seat, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: तव करत्वा तव तद दंसनाभिरामासु पक्वं शच्या नि दीधः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava kratvā tava tad daṃsanābhirāmāsu pakvaṃ śacyā ni dīdhaḥ |
Translation: 6 Thou with thy wisdom, power, and works of wonder, hast stored the ripe milk in the raw cows' udders

Sanskit Text: और्णोर्दुर उस्रियाभ्यो वि दर्ळ्होदूर्वाद गा अस्र्जो अङगिरस्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aurṇordura usriyābhyo vi dṛḷhodūrvād ghā asṛjo aṅghirasvān ||
Translation: Unbarred the firm doors for the kine of Morning, and, with the Aṅgirases, set free the cattle.

Sanskit Text: पप्राथ कषां महि दण्सो वयुर्वीमुप दयां रष्वो बर्हदिन्द्र सतभायः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: paprātha kṣāṃ mahi daṇso vyurvīmupa dyāṃ ṛṣvo bṛhadindra stabhāyaḥ |
Translation: 7 Thou hast spread out wide earth, a mighty marvel, and, high thyself, propped lofty heaven, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: अधारयो रोदसी देवपुत्रे परत्ने मातरा यह्वी रतस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhārayo rodasī devaputre pratne mātarā yahvī ṛtasya ||
Translation: Both worlds, whose Sons are Gods, thou hast supported, young, Mothers from old time ofholy Order.

Sanskit Text: अध तवा विश्वे पुर इन्द्र देवा एकं तवसं दधिरे भराय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha tvā viśve pura indra devā ekaṃ tavasaṃ dadhire bharāya |
Translation: 8 Yea, Indra, all the Deities installed thee their one strong Champion in the van for battle.

Sanskit Text: अदेवो यदभ्यौहिष्ट देवान सवर्षाता वर्णत इन्द्रमत्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adevo yadabhyauhiṣṭa devān svarṣātā vṛṇata indramatra ||
Translation: What time the godless was the Gods’ assailant, Indra they chose to win the light of heaven.

Sanskit Text: अध दयौश्चित ते अप सा नु वज्राद दवितानमद भियसा सवस्य मन्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha dyauścit te apa sā nu vajrād dvitānamad bhiyasā svasya manyoḥ |
Translation: 9 Yea, e’en that heaven itself of old bent backward before thy bolt, in terror of its anger,

Sanskit Text: अहिं यदिन्द्रो अभ्योहसानं नि चिद विश्वायुः शयथे जघान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahiṃ yadindro abhyohasānaṃ ni cid viśvāyuḥ śayathe jaghāna ||
Translation: When Indra, life of every living creature, smote down within his lair the assailing Dragon.

Sanskit Text: अध तवष्टा ते मह उग्र वज्रं सहस्रभ्र्ष्टिं वव्र्तच्छताश्रिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha tvaṣṭā te maha ughra vajraṃ sahasrabhṛṣṭiṃ vavṛtacchatāśrim |
Translation: 10 Yea, Strong One! Tvaṣṭar turned for thee, the Mighty, the bolt with thousand spikes and hundred edges,

Sanskit Text: निकाममरमणसं येन नवन्तमहिं सं पिणग्र्जीषिन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nikāmamaramaṇasaṃ yena navantamahiṃ saṃ piṇaghṛjīṣin ||
Translation: Eager and prompt at will, wherewith thou crushedst the boasting Dragon, O impetuous Hero.

Sanskit Text: वर्धान यं विश्वे मरुतः सजोषाः पचच्छतं महिषानिन्द्र तुभ्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vardhān yaṃ viśve marutaḥ sajoṣāḥ pacacchataṃ mahiṣānindra tubhyam |
Translation: 11 He dressed a hundred buffaloes, O Indra, for thee whom all accordant Maruts strengthen.

Sanskit Text: पूषा विष्णुस्त्रीणि सरांसि धावन वर्त्रहणं मदिरमंशुमस्मै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūṣā viṣṇustrīṇi sarāṃsi dhāvan vṛtrahaṇaṃ madiramaṃśumasmai ||
Translation: He, Pūṣan Viṣṇu, poured forth three great vessels to him, the juice that cheers, that slaughters Vṛtra.

Sanskit Text: आ कषोदो महि वर्तं नदीनां परिष्ठितमस्र्ज ऊर्मिमपाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā kṣodo mahi vṛtaṃ nadīnāṃ pariṣṭhitamasṛja ūrmimapām |
Translation: 12 Thou settest free the rushing wave of waters, the floods' great swell encompassed and obstructed.

Sanskit Text: तासामनु परवत इन्द्र पन्थां परार्दयो नीचीरपसः समुद्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāsāmanu pravata indra panthāṃ prārdayo nīcīrapasaḥ samudram ||
Translation: Along steep slopes their course thou tumedst, Indra, directed downward, speeding to the ocean.

Sanskit Text: एवा ता विश्वा चक्र्वांसमिन्द्रं महामुग्रमजुर्यं सहोदाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā tā viśvā cakṛvāṃsamindraṃ mahāmughramajuryaṃ sahodām |
Translation: 13 So may our new prayer bring thee to protect us, thee well-armed Hero with thy bolt of thunder,

Sanskit Text: सुवीरं तवा सवायुधं सुवज्रमा बरह्म नव्यमवसे वव्र्त्यात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvīraṃ tvā svāyudhaṃ suvajramā brahma navyamavase vavṛtyāt ||
Translation: Indra, who made these worlds, the Strong, the ty, who never groweth old, the victory-giver.

Sanskit Text: स नो वाजाय शरवस इषे च राये धेहि दयुमत इन्द्र विप्रान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no vājāya śravasa iṣe ca rāye dhehi dyumata indra viprān |
Translation: 14 So, Indra, form us brilliant holy singers for strength, for glory, and for food and riches.

Sanskit Text: भरद्वाजे नर्वत इन्द्र सूरीन दिवि च समैधि पार्ये न इन्द्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharadvāje nṛvata indra sūrīn divi ca smaidhi pārye na indra ||
Translation: Give Bharadvāja hero patrons, Indra Indra, be ours upon the day of trial.

Sanskit Text: अया वाजं देवहितं सनेम मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayā vājaṃ devahitaṃ sanema madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ ||
Translation: 15 With this may we obtain strength God-appointed, and brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

Sanskit Text: तमु षटुहि यो अभिभूत्योजा वन्वन्नवातः पुरुहूत इन्द्रः |
