Sanskrit Transliteration: tamu ṣṭuhi yo abhibhūtyojā vanvannavātaḥ puruhūta indraḥ |
Translation: 1. GLORIFY him whose might is all-surpassing, Indra the much-invoked who fights uninjured.

Sanskit Text: अषाळ्हमुग्रं सहमानमाभिर्गीर्भिर्वर्ध वर्षभं चर्षणीनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṣāḷhamughraṃ sahamānamābhirghīrbhirvardha vṛṣabhaṃ carṣaṇīnām ||
Translation: Magnify with these songs the never-vanquished, the Strong, the Bull of men, the Mighty Victor.

Sanskit Text: स युध्मः सत्वा खजक्र्त समद्वा तुविम्रक्षो नदनुमान रजीषी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa yudhmaḥ satvā khajakṛt samadvā tuvimrakṣo nadanumān ṛjīṣī |
Translation: 2 He, Champion, Hero, Warrior, Lord of battles, impetuous, loudly roaring, great destroyer,

Sanskit Text: बर्हद्रेणुश्च्यवनो मानुषीणामेकः कर्ष्टीनामभवत सहावा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhadreṇuścyavano mānuṣīṇāmekaḥ kṛṣṭīnāmabhavat sahāvā ||
Translation: Who whirls the dust on high, alone, oerthrower, hath made all races of mankind his subjects.

Sanskit Text: तवं ह नु तयददमायो दस्यून्रेकः कर्ष्टीरवनोरार्याय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ ha nu tyadadamāyo dasyūnrekaḥ kṛṣṭīravanorāryāya |
Translation: 3 Thou, thou alone, hast tamed the Dasyus; singly thou hast subdued the people for the Ārya.

Sanskit Text: अस्ति सविन नु वीर्यं तत त इन्द्र न सविदस्ति तद रतुथा वि वोचः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asti svin nu vīryaṃ tat ta indra na svidasti tad ṛtuthā vi vocaḥ ||
Translation: In this, or is it not, thine hero exploit, Indra? Declare it at the proper season.

Sanskit Text: सदिद धि ते तुविजातस्य मन्ये सहः सहिष्ठ तुरतस्तुरस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadid dhi te tuvijātasya manye sahaḥ sahiṣṭha turatasturasya |
Translation: 4 For true, I deem, thy strength is, thine the Mighty, thine, O Most Potent, thine the Conquering Victor;

Sanskit Text: उग्रमुग्रस्य तवसस्तवीयो.अरध्रस्य रध्रतुरो बभूव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughramughrasya tavasastavīyo.aradhrasya radhraturo babhūva ||
Translation: Strong, of the strong, Most Mighty, of the mighty, thine, driver of the churl to acts of bounty.

Sanskit Text: तन नः परत्नं सख्यमस्तु युष्मे इत्था वदद्भिर्वलमङगिरोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan naḥ pratnaṃ sakhyamastu yuṣme itthā vadadbhirvalamaṅghirobhiḥ |
Translation: 5 Be this our ancient bond of friendship with you and with Aṅgirases here who speak of Vala.

Sanskit Text: हन्नच्युतच्युद दस्मेषयन्तं रणोः पुरो वि दुरोस्य विश्वाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hannacyutacyud dasmeṣayantaṃ ṛṇoḥ puro vi duroasya viśvāḥ ||
Translation: Thou, Wondrous, Shaker of things firm, didst smite him in his fresh strength, and force his doors and castles.

Sanskit Text: स हि धीभिर्हव्यो अस्त्युग्र ईशानक्र्न महति वर्त्रतूर्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi dhībhirhavyo astyughra īśānakṛn mahati vṛtratūrye |
Translation: 6 With holy thoughts must he be called, the Mighty, showing his power in the great fight with Vṛtra.

Sanskit Text: स तोकसाता तनये स वज्री वितन्तसाय्यो अभवत समत्सु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tokasātā tanaye sa vajrī vitantasāyyo abhavat samatsu ||
Translation: He must be called to give us seed and offspring, the Thunderer must he moved and sped to battle.

Sanskit Text: स मज्मना जनिम मानुषाणाममर्त्येन नाम्नाति पर सर्स्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa majmanā janima mānuṣāṇāmamartyena nāmnāti pra sarsre |
Translation: 7 He in his might, with name that lives for ever, hath far surpassed all human generations.

Sanskit Text: स दयुम्नेन स शवसोत राया स वीर्येण नर्तमः समोकाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa dyumnena sa śavasota rāyā sa vīryeṇa nṛtamaḥ samokāḥ ||
Translation: He, most heroic, hath his home with splendour, with glory and with riches and with valour.

Sanskit Text: स यो न मुहे न मिथू जनो भूत सुमन्तुनामा चुमुरिं धुनिं च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa yo na muhe na mithū jano bhūt sumantunāmā cumuriṃ dhuniṃ ca |
Translation: 8 Stranger to guile, who ne’er was false or faithless, bearing a name that may be well remembered,

Sanskit Text: वर्णक पिप्रुं शम्बरं शुष्णमिन्द्रः पुरांच्यौत्नाय शयथाय नू चित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṇak pipruṃ śambaraṃ śuṣṇamindraḥ purāṃcyautnāya śayathāya nū cit ||
Translation: Indra crushed Cumuri, Dhuni, Śambara, Pipru, and Śuṣṇa, that their castles fell in ruin.

Sanskit Text: उदावता तवक्षसा पन्यसा च वर्त्रहत्याय रथमिन्द्र तिष्ठ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udāvatā tvakṣasā panyasā ca vṛtrahatyāya rathamindra tiṣṭha |
Translation: 9 With saving might that must be praised and lauded, Indra, ascend thy car to smite down Vṛtra.

Sanskit Text: धिष्व वज्रं हस्त आ दक्षिणत्राभि पर मन्द पुरुदत्र मायाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiṣva vajraṃ hasta ā dakṣiṇatrābhi pra manda purudatra māyāḥ ||
Translation: In thy right hand hold fast thy bolt of thunder, and weaken, Bounteous Lord, his art and magic.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्न शुष्कं वनमिन्द्र हेती रक्षो नि धक्ष्यशनिर्न भीमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirna śuṣkaṃ vanamindra hetī rakṣo ni dhakṣyaśanirna bhīmā |
Translation: 10 As Agni, as the dart burns the dry forest, like the dread shaft burn down the fiends, O Indra;

Sanskit Text: गम्भीरय रष्वया यो रुरोजाध्वानयद दुरिता दम्भयच्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghambhīraya ṛṣvayā yo rurojādhvānayad duritā dambhayacca ||
Translation: Thou who with high deep-reaching spear hast broken, hast covered over mischief and destroyed it.

Sanskit Text: आ सहस्रं पथिभिरिन्द्र राया तुविद्युम्न तुविवाजेभिरर्वाक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā sahasraṃ pathibhirindra rāyā tuvidyumna tuvivājebhirarvāk |
Translation: 11 With wealth, by thousand paths come hither, Agni, paths that bring ample strength, O thou Most Splendid.

Sanskit Text: याहि सूनो सहसो यस्य नू चिददेव ईशे पुरुहूत योतोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāhi sūno sahaso yasya nū cidadeva īśe puruhūta yotoḥ ||
Translation: Come, Son of Strength, o’er whom, Invoked of many! the godless hath no power to keep thee distant.

Sanskit Text: पर तुविद्युम्नस्य सथविरस्य घर्ष्वेर्दिवो ररप्शे महिमा पर्थिव्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra tuvidyumnasya sthavirasya ghṛṣverdivo rarapśe mahimā pṛthivyāḥ |
Translation: 12 From heaven, from earth is bruited forth the greatness of him the firm, the fiery, the resplendent.

Sanskit Text: नास्य शत्रुर्न परतिमानमस्ति न परतिष्ठिःपुरुमायस्य सह्योः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāsya śatrurna pratimānamasti na pratiṣṭhiḥpurumāyasya sahyoḥ ||
Translation: No foe hath he, no counterpart, no refuge is there from him the Conqueror full of wisdom

Sanskit Text: पर तत ते अद्या करणं कर्तं भूत कुत्सं यदायुमतिथिग्वमस्मै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra tat te adyā karaṇaṃ kṛtaṃ bhūt kutsaṃ yadāyumatithighvamasmai |
Translation: 13 This day the deed that thou hast done is famous, when thou, for him, with many thousand others

Sanskit Text: पुरू सहस्रा नि शिशा अभि कषामुत तूर्वयाणं धर्षता निनेथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purū sahasrā ni śiśā abhi kṣāmut tūrvayāṇaṃ dhṛṣatā ninetha ||
Translation: Laidest low Kutsa, Āyu, Atithigva, and boldly didst deliver Tūrvayāṇa.

Sanskit Text: अनु तवाहिघ्ने अध देव देवा मदन विश्वे कवितमं कवीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu tvāhighne adha deva devā madan viśve kavitamaṃ kavīnām |
Translation: 14 In thee, O God, the wisest of the Sages, all Gods were joyful when thou slewest Ahi.

Sanskit Text: करो यत्र वरिवो बाधिताय दिवे जनाय तन्वे गर्णानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: karo yatra varivo bādhitāya dive janāya tanve ghṛṇānaḥ ||
Translation: When lauded for thyself, thou gavest freedom to sore-afflicted Heaven and to the people.

Sanskit Text: अनु दयावाप्र्थिवी तत त ओजो.अमर्त्या जिहत इन्द्र देवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu dyāvāpṛthivī tat ta ojo.amartyā jihata indra devāḥ |
Translation: 15 This power of thine both heaven and earth acknowledge, the deathless Gods acknowledge it, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: कर्ष्वा कर्त्नो अक्र्तं यत ते अस्त्युक्थं नवीयो जनयस्व यज्ञैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṣvā kṛtno akṛtaṃ yat te astyukthaṃ navīyo janayasva yajñaiḥ ||
Translation: Do what thou ne’er hast done, O Mighty Worker: beget a new hymn at thy sacrifices.

Sanskit Text: इमा उ तवा पुरुतमस्य कारोर्हव्यं वीर हव्या हवन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā u tvā purutamasya kārorhavyaṃ vīra havyā havante |
Translation: 1. THESE the most constant singer's invocations call thee who art to be invoked, O Hero;

Sanskit Text: धियो रथेष्ठामजरं नवीयो रयिर्विभूतिरीयते वचस्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiyo ratheṣṭhāmajaraṃ navīyo rayirvibhūtirīyate vacasyā ||
Translation: Hymns call anew the chariot-borne, Eternal: by eloquence men gain abundant riches.

Sanskit Text: तमु सतुष इन्द्रं यो विदानो गिर्वाहसं गीर्भीर्यज्ञव्र्द्धम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamu stuṣa indraṃ yo vidāno ghirvāhasaṃ ghīrbhīryajñavṛddham |
Translation: 2 I praise that Indra, known to all men, honoured with songs, extolled with hymns at sacrifices,

Sanskit Text: यस्य दिवमति मह्ना पर्थिव्याः पुरुमायस्य रिरिचेमहित्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya divamati mahnā pṛthivyāḥ purumāyasya riricemahitvam ||
Translation: Whose majesty, rich in wondrous arts, surpasseth the magnitude of earth, and heaven in greatness.

Sanskit Text: स इत तमो.अवयुनं ततन्वत सूर्येण वयुनवच्चकार |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa it tamo.avayunaṃ tatanvat sūryeṇa vayunavaccakāra |
Translation: 3 He hath made pathways, with the Sun to aid him, throughout the darkness that extended pathless.

Sanskit Text: कदा ते मर्ता अम्र्तस्य धामेयक्षन्तो न मिनन्ति सवधावः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadā te martā amṛtasya dhāmeyakṣanto na minanti svadhāvaḥ ||
Translation: Mortals who yearn to worship ne’er dishonour, O Mighty God, thy Law who art Immortal.

Sanskit Text: यस्ता चकार स कुह सविदिन्द्रः कमा जनं चरति कासु विक्षु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yastā cakāra sa kuha svidindraḥ kamā janaṃ carati kāsu vikṣu |
Translation: 4 And he who did these things, where is that Indra? among what tribes? what people doth he visit?

Sanskit Text: कस्ते यज्ञो मनसे शं वराय को अर्क इन्द्रकतमः स होता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaste yajño manase śaṃ varāya ko arka indrakatamaḥ sa hotā ||
Translation: What sacrifice contents thy mind , and wishes? What priest among them all? what hymn, O Indra?

Sanskit Text: इदा हि ते वेविषतः पुराजाः परत्नास आसुः पुरुक्र्त सखायः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idā hi te veviṣataḥ purājāḥ pratnāsa āsuḥ purukṛt sakhāyaḥ |
Translation: 5 Yea, here were they who, born of old, have served thee, thy friends of ancient time, thou active Worker.

Sanskit Text: ये मध्यमास उत नूतनास उतावमस्य पुरुहूत बोधि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye madhyamāsa uta nūtanāsa utāvamasya puruhūta bodhi ||
Translation: Bethink thee now of these, Invoked of many! the midmost and the recent, and the youngest.

Sanskit Text: तं पर्छन्तो.अवरासः पराणि परत्ना त इन्द्र शरुत्यानु येमुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ pṛchanto.avarāsaḥ parāṇi pratnā ta indra śrutyānu yemuḥ |
Translation: 6 Inquiring after him, thy later servants, Indra, have gained thy former old traditions.

Sanskit Text: अर्चामसि वीर बरह्मवाहो यादेव विद्म तात तवा महान्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arcāmasi vīra brahmavāho yādeva vidma tāt tvā mahāntam ||
Translation: Hero, to whom the prayer is brought, we praise thee as great for that wherein we know thee mighty.

Sanskit Text: अभि तवा पाजो रक्षसो वि तस्थे महि जज्ञानमभि तत सु तिष्ठ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tvā pājo rakṣaso vi tasthe mahi jajñānamabhi tat su tiṣṭha |
Translation: 7 The demon's strength is gathered fast against thee: great as that strength hath grown, go forth to meet it.

Sanskit Text: तव परत्नेन युज्येन सख्या वज्रेण धर्ष्णो अपता नुदस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava pratnena yujyena sakhyā vajreṇa dhṛṣṇo apatā nudasva ||
Translation: With thine own ancient friend and companion, the thunderbolt, brave Champion! drive it backward.

Sanskit Text: स तु शरुधीन्द्र नूतनस्य बरह्मण्यतो वीर कारुधायः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tu śrudhīndra nūtanasya brahmaṇyato vīra kārudhāyaḥ |
Translation: 8 Hear, too, the prayer of this thy present beadsman, O Indra, Hero, cherishing the singer.

Sanskit Text: तवं हयापिः परदिवि पितॄणां शश्वद बभूथ सुहव एष्टौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hyāpiḥ pradivi pitṝṇāṃ śaśvad babhūtha suhava eṣṭau ||
Translation: For thou wast aye our fathers' Friend aforetime, still swift to listen to their supplication.

Sanskit Text: परोतये वरुणं मित्रमिन्द्रं मरुतः कर्ष्वावसे नो अद्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: protaye varuṇaṃ mitramindraṃ marutaḥ kṛṣvāvase no adya |
Translation: 9 Bring to our help this day, for our protection, Varuṇa, Mitra , Indra, and the Maruts,

Sanskit Text: पर पूषणं विष्णुमग्निं पुरन्धिं सवितारमोषधीः पर्वतांश्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra pūṣaṇaṃ viṣṇumaghniṃ purandhiṃ savitāramoṣadhīḥ parvatāṃśca ||
Translation: Pūṣan and Viṣṇu, Agni and Purandhi, Savitar also, and the Plants and Mountains.

Sanskit Text: इम उ तवा पुरुशाक परयज्यो जरितारो अभ्यर्चन्त्यर्कैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ima u tvā puruśāka prayajyo jaritāro abhyarcantyarkaiḥ |
Translation: 10 The singers here exalt with hymns and praises thee who art very Mighty and Most Holy.

Sanskit Text: शरुधी हवमा हुवतो हुवानो न तवावानन्यो अम्र्त तवदस्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrudhī havamā huvato huvāno na tvāvānanyo amṛta tvadasti ||
Translation: Hear, when invoked, the invoker's invocation. Beside thee there is nonelike thee, Immortal!

Sanskit Text: नू म आ वाचमुप याहि विद्वान विश्वेभिः सूनो सहसो यजत्रैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū ma ā vācamupa yāhi vidvān viśvebhiḥ sūno sahaso yajatraiḥ |
Translation: 11 Now to my words come quickly thou who knowest, O Son of Strength, with all who claim our worship,

Sanskit Text: ये अग्निजिह्वा रतसाप आसुर्ये मनुं चक्रुरुपरं दसाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye aghnijihvā ṛtasāpa āsurye manuṃ cakruruparaṃ dasāya ||
Translation: Who visit sacred rites, whose tongue is Agni, Gods who made Manu stronger than the Dasyu.

Sanskit Text: स नो बोधि पुरेता सुगेषूत दुर्गेषु पथिक्र्द विदानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no bodhi puraetā sugheṣūta durgheṣu pathikṛd vidānaḥ |
Translation: 12 On good and evil ways be thou our Leader, thou who art known to all as Path-preparer.

Sanskit Text: ये अश्रमास उरवो वहिष्ठास्तेभिर्न इन्द्राभि वक्षि वाजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye aśramāsa uravo vahiṣṭhāstebhirna indrābhi vakṣi vājam ||
Translation: Bring power to us, O Indra, with thy Horses, Steeds that are best to draw, broad-backed, unwearied.

Sanskit Text: य एक इद धव्यश्चर्षणीनामिन्द्रं तं गीर्भिरभ्यर्च आभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya eka id dhavyaścarṣaṇīnāmindraṃ taṃ ghīrbhirabhyarca ābhiḥ |
Translation: 1. WITH these my hymns I glorify that Indra who is alone to be invoked by mortals,

Sanskit Text: यः पत्यते वर्षभो वर्ष्ण्यावान सत्यः सत्वा पुरुमायः सहस्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ patyate vṛṣabho vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā purumāyaḥ sahasvān ||
Translation: The Lord, the Mighty One, of manly vigour, victorious, Hero, true, and full of wisdom.

Sanskit Text: तमु नः पूर्वे पितरो नवग्वाः सप्त विप्रासो अभि वाजयन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamu naḥ pūrve pitaro navaghvāḥ sapta viprāso abhi vājayantaḥ |
Translation: 2 Our sires of old,. Navagvas, sages seven, while urging him to show his might, extolled him,

Sanskit Text: नक्षद्दाभं ततुरिं पर्वतेष्ठामद्रोघवाचं मतिभिः शविष्ठम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nakṣaddābhaṃ taturiṃ parvateṣṭhāmadroghavācaṃ matibhiḥ śaviṣṭham ||
Translation: Dwelling on heights, swift, smiting down opponents, guileless in word, and in his thoughts most mighty.

Sanskit Text: तमीमह इन्द्रमस्य रायः पुरुवीरस्य नर्वतः पुरुक्षोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamīmaha indramasya rāyaḥ puruvīrasya nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ |
Translation: 3 We seek that Indra to obtain his riches that bring much food, and men, and store of heroes.

Sanskit Text: यो अस्क्र्धोयुरजरः सवर्वान तमा भर हरिवो मादयध्यै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo askṛdhoyurajaraḥ svarvān tamā bhara harivo mādayadhyai ||
Translation: Bring us, Lord of Bay Steeds, to make us joyful, celestial wealth, abundant, undecaying.

Sanskit Text: तन नो वि वोचो यदि ते पुरा चिज्जरितार आनशुः सुम्नमिन्द्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no vi voco yadi te purā cijjaritāra ānaśuḥ sumnamindra |
Translation: 4 Tell thou us this, if at thy hand aforetime the earlier singers have obtained good fortune,

Sanskit Text: कस्ते भागः किं वयो दुध्र खिद्वः पुरुहूत पुरूवसो.असुरघ्नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaste bhāghaḥ kiṃ vayo dudhra khidvaḥ puruhūta purūvaso.asuraghnaḥ ||
Translation: What is thy share and portion, Strong Subduer, Asura-slayer, rich, invoked of many?

Sanskit Text: तं पर्छन्ती वज्रहस्तं रथेष्ठामिन्द्रं वेपी वक्वरीयस्य नू गीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ pṛchantī vajrahastaṃ ratheṣṭhāmindraṃ vepī vakvarīyasya nū ghīḥ |
Translation: 5 He who for car-borne Indra, armed with thunder, hath a hymn, craving, deeply-piercing, fluent,

Sanskit Text: तुविग्राभं तुविकूर्मिं रभोदां गातुमिषे नक्षते तुम्रमछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tuvighrābhaṃ tuvikūrmiṃ rabhodāṃ ghātumiṣe nakṣate tumramacha ||
Translation: Who sends a song effectual, firmly-grasping, and strength-bestowing, he comes near the mighty.

Sanskit Text: अया ह तयं मायया वाव्र्धानं मनोजुवा सवतवः पर्वतेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayā ha tyaṃ māyayā vāvṛdhānaṃ manojuvā svatavaḥ parvatena |
Translation: 6 Strong of thyself, thou by this art hast shattered, with thought-swift Parvata, him who waxed against thee,

Sanskit Text: अच्युता चिद वीळिता सवोजो रुजो वि दर्ळ्हा धर्षता विरप्शिन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: acyutā cid vīḷitā svojo rujo vi dṛḷhā dhṛṣatā virapśin ||
Translation: And, Mightiest! roaring! boldly rent in pieces things that were firmly fixed and never shaken.

Sanskit Text: तं वो धिया नव्यस्या शविष्ठं परत्नं परत्नवत परितंसयध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vo dhiyā navyasyā śaviṣṭhaṃ pratnaṃ pratnavat paritaṃsayadhyai |
Translation: 7 Him will we fit for you with new devotion, the strongest Ancient One, in ancient manner.

Sanskit Text: स नो वक्षदनिमानः सुवह्मेन्द्रो विश्वान्यतिदुर्गहाणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no vakṣadanimānaḥ suvahmendro viśvānyatidurghahāṇi ||
Translation: So may that Indra, boundless, faithful Leader, conduct us o’er all places hard to traverse.

Sanskit Text: आ जनाय दरुह्वणे पार्थिवानि दिव्यानि दीपयो.अन्तरिक्षा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā janāya druhvaṇe pārthivāni divyāni dīpayo.antarikṣā |
Translation: 8 Thou for the people who oppress hast kindled the earthly firmament and that of heaven.

Sanskit Text: तपा वर्षन विश्वतः शोचिषा तान बरह्मद्विषे शोचय कषामपश्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tapā vṛṣan viśvataḥ śociṣā tān brahmadviṣe śocaya kṣāmapaśca ||
Translation: With heat, O Bull, on every side consume them: heat earth and flood for him who hates devotion.

Sanskit Text: भुवो जनस्य दिव्यस्य राजा पार्थिवस्य जगतस्त्वेषसन्द्र्क |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhuvo janasya divyasya rājā pārthivasya jaghatastveṣasandṛk |
Translation: 9 Of all the Heavenly Folk, of earthly creatures thou art the King, O God of splendid aspect.

Sanskit Text: धिष्व वज्रं दक्षिण इन्द्र हस्ते विश्वा अजुर्य दयसे वि मायाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiṣva vajraṃ dakṣiṇa indra haste viśvā ajurya dayase vi māyāḥ ||
Translation: In thy right hand, O Indra, grasp die thunder: Eternal! thou destroyest all enchantments.

Sanskit Text: आ संयतमिन्द्र णः सवस्तिं शत्रुतूर्याय बर्हतीमम्र्ध्राम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā saṃyatamindra ṇaḥ svastiṃ śatrutūryāya bṛhatīmamṛdhrām |
Translation: 10 Give us confirmed prosperity, O Indra, vast and exhaustless for the foe's subduing.

Sanskit Text: यया दासान्यार्याणि वर्त्रा करो वज्रिन सुतुका नाहुषाणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayā dāsānyāryāṇi vṛtrā karo vajrin sutukā nāhuṣāṇi ||
Translation: Strengthen therewith the Ārya's hate and Dāsa's, and let the arms of Nahusas be mighty.

Sanskit Text: स नो नियुद्भिः पुरुहूत वेधो विश्ववाराभिरा गहि परयज्यो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no niyudbhiḥ puruhūta vedho viśvavārābhirā ghahi prayajyo |
Translation: 11 Come with thy team which brings all blessings hither, Disposer, much-invoked, exceeding holy.

Sanskit Text: न या अदेवो वरते न देव आभिर्याहि तूयमा मद्र्यद्रिक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yā adevo varate na deva ābhiryāhi tūyamā madryadrik ||
Translation: Thou whom no fiend, no God can stay or hinder, come swittly with these Steeds in my direction.

Sanskit Text: सुत इत तवं निमिश्ल इन्द्र सोमे सतोमे बरह्मणि शस्यमानौक्थे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suta it tvaṃ nimiśla indra some stome brahmaṇi śasyamānaukthe |
Translation: 1. THOU art attached to pressed-out Soma, Indra, at laud, at prayer, and when the hymn is chanted;

Sanskit Text: यद वा युक्ताभ्यां मघवन हरिभ्यां बिभ्रद वज्रम्बाह्वोरिन्द्र यासि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā yuktābhyāṃ maghavan haribhyāṃ bibhrad vajrambāhvorindra yāsi ||
Translation: Or when with yoked Bays, Maghavan, thou comest, O Indra, bearing in thine arms the thunder.

Sanskit Text: यद वा दिवि पार्ये सुष्विमिन्द्र वर्त्रहत्ये.अवसि शूरसातौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā divi pārye suṣvimindra vṛtrahatye.avasi śūrasātau |
Translation: 2 Or when on that decisive day thou holpest the presser of the juice at Vṛtra's slaughter;

Sanskit Text: यद वा दक्षस्य बिभ्युषो अबिभ्यदरन्धयः शर्धत इन्द्र दस्यून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā dakṣasya bibhyuṣo abibhyadarandhayaḥ śardhata indra dasyūn ||
Translation: Or when thou, while the strong one feared, undaunted, gavest to death, Indra, the daring Dasyus.

Sanskit Text: पाता सुतमिन्द्रो अस्तु सोमं परणेनीरुग्रो जरितारमूती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pātā sutamindro astu somaṃ praṇenīrughro jaritāramūtī |
Translation: 3 Let Indra drink the pressed-out Soma, Helper and mighty Guide of him who sings his praises.

Sanskit Text: कर्ता वीराय सुष्वय उ लोकं दाता वसु सतुवते कीरये चित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kartā vīrāya suṣvaya u lokaṃ dātā vasu stuvate kīraye cit ||
Translation: He gives the hero room who pours oblations, and treasure even to the lowly singer.

Sanskit Text: गन्तेयान्ति सवना हरिभ्यां बभ्रिर्वज्रं पपिः सोमं ददिर्गाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghanteyānti savanā haribhyāṃ babhrirvajraṃ papiḥ somaṃ dadirghāḥ |
Translation: 4 E’en humble rites with his Bay steeds he visits: he wields the bolt, drinks Soma, gives us cattle.

Sanskit Text: कर्ता वीरं नर्यं सर्ववीरं शरोता हवंग्र्णत सतोमवाहाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kartā vīraṃ naryaṃ sarvavīraṃ śrotā havaṃghṛṇata stomavāhāḥ ||
Translation: He makes the valiant rich in store of heroes, accepts our praise and hears the singer's calling.

Sanskit Text: अस्मै वयं यद वावान तद विविष्म इन्द्राय यो नः परदिवो अपस कः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmai vayaṃ yad vāvāna tad viviṣma indrāya yo naḥ pradivo apas kaḥ |
Translation: 5 What he hath longed for we have brought to Indra, who from the days of old hath done us service.

Sanskit Text: सुते सोमे सतुमसि शंसदुक्थेन्द्राय बरह्म वर्धनं यथासत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sute some stumasi śaṃsadukthendrāya brahma vardhanaṃ yathāsat ||
Translation: While Soma flows we will sing hymn, and laud him, so that our prayer may streng. then Indra's vigour.

Sanskit Text: बरह्माणि हि चक्र्षे वर्धनानि तावत त इन्द्र मतिभिर्विविष्मः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmāṇi hi cakṛṣe vardhanāni tāvat ta indra matibhirviviṣmaḥ |
Translation: 6 Thou hast made prayer the means of thine exalting, therefore we wait on thee with hymns, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: सुते सोमे सुतपाः शन्तमानि रान्द्र्या करियास्म वक्षणानि यज्ञैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sute some sutapāḥ śantamāni rāndryā kriyāsma vakṣaṇāni yajñaiḥ ||
Translation: May we, by the pressed Soma, Somadrinker! bring thee, with sacrifice, blissful sweet refreshment.

Sanskit Text: स नो बोधि पुरोळाशं रराणः पिबा तु सोमं गोर्जीकमिन्द्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no bodhi puroḷāśaṃ rarāṇaḥ pibā tu somaṃ ghoṛjīkamindra |
Translation: 7 Mark well our sacrificial cake, delighted Indra, drink Soma and the milk commingled.

Sanskit Text: एदं बर्हिर्यजमानस्य सीदोरुं कर्धि तवायत उ लोकम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: edaṃ barhiryajamānasya sīdoruṃ kṛdhi tvāyata u lokam ||
Translation: Here on the sacrificer's grass be seated: give ample room to thy devoted servant.

Sanskit Text: स मन्दस्वा हयनु जोषमुग्र पर तवा यज्ञास इमे अश्नुवन्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa mandasvā hyanu joṣamughra pra tvā yajñāsa ime aśnuvantu |
Translation: 8 O Mighty One, be joyful as thou willest. Let these our sacrifices reach and find thee;

Sanskit Text: परेमे हवासः पुरुहूतमस्मे आ तवेयं धीरवस इन्द्र यम्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: preme havāsaḥ puruhūtamasme ā tveyaṃ dhīravasa indra yamyāḥ ||
Translation: And may this hymn and these our invocations turn thee, whom many men invoke, to help us.

Sanskit Text: तं वः सखायः सं यथा सुतेषु सोमेभिरीं पर्णता भोजमिन्द्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vaḥ sakhāyaḥ saṃ yathā suteṣu somebhirīṃ pṛṇatā bhojamindram |
Translation: 9 Friends, when thejuices flow, replenish duly your own, your bounteous Indra with the Soma.

Sanskit Text: कुवित तस्मा असति नो भराय न सुष्विमिन्द्रो.अवसे मर्धाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvit tasmā asati no bharāya na suṣvimindro.avase mṛdhāti ||
Translation: Will it not aid him to support us? Indra. spares him who sheds the juice to win his favour.

Sanskit Text: एवेदिन्द्रः सुते अस्तावि सोमे भरद्वाजेषु कषयदिन मघोनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evedindraḥ sute astāvi some bharadvājeṣu kṣayadin maghonaḥ |
Translation: 10 While Soma flowed, thus Indra hath been lauded, Ruler of nobles, mid the Bharadvājas,

Sanskit Text: असद यथा जरित्र उत सूरिरिन्द्रो रायो विश्ववारस्य दाता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asad yathā jaritra uta sūririndro rāyo viśvavārasya dātā ||
Translation: That Indra may become the singer's patron and give him wealth in every kind of treasure.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा मद इन्द्रे शलोक उक्था सचा सोमेषु सुतपा रजीषी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā mada indre śloka ukthā sacā someṣu sutapā ṛjīṣī |
Translation: 1. STRONG rapturous joy, praise, glory are with Indra: impetuous God, he quaffs the juice of Soma:

Sanskit Text: अर्चत्र्यो मघवा नर्भ्य उक्थैर्द्युक्षो राजा गिरामक्षितोतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arcatryo maghavā nṛbhya ukthairdyukṣo rājā ghirāmakṣitotiḥ ||
Translation: That Maghavan whom men must laud with singing, Heaven-dweller, King of songs, whose help is lasting.

Sanskit Text: ततुरिर्वीरो नर्यो विचेताः शरोता हवं गर्णत उर्व्यूतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taturirvīro naryo vicetāḥ śrotā havaṃ ghṛṇata urvyūtiḥ |
Translation: 2 He, Friend of man, most wise, victorious Hero, hears, with far-reaching aid, the singer call him.

Sanskit Text: वसुः शंसो नरां कारुधाया वाजी सतुतो विदथे दाति वाजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasuḥ śaṃso narāṃ kārudhāyā vājī stuto vidathe dāti vājam ||
Translation: Excellent, Praise of Men, the bard's Supporter, Strong, he gives strength, extolled in holy synod.

Sanskit Text: अक्षो न चक्र्योः शूर बर्हन पर ते मह्ना रिरिचे रोदस्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: akṣo na cakryoḥ śūra bṛhan pra te mahnā ririce rodasyoḥ |
Translation: 3 The lofty axle of thy wheels, O Hero, is not surpassed by heaven and earth in greatness.

Sanskit Text: वर्क्षस्य नु ते पुरुहूत वया वयूतयो रुरुहुरिन्द्र पूर्वीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛkṣasya nu te puruhūta vayā vyūtayo ruruhurindra pūrvīḥ ||
Translation: Like branches of a tree, Invoked of many manifold aids spring forth from thee, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: शचीवतस्ते पुरुशाक शाका गवामिव सरुतयः संचरणीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śacīvataste puruśāka śākā ghavāmiva srutayaḥ saṃcaraṇīḥ |
Translation: 4 Strong Lord, thine energies, endowed with vigour, are like the paths of kine converging homeward.

Sanskit Text: वत्सानां न तन्तयस्त इन्द्र दामन्वन्तो अदामानः सुदामन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vatsānāṃ na tantayasta indra dāmanvanto adāmānaḥ sudāman ||
Translation: Like bonds of cord, Indra, that bind the younglings, no bonds are they, O thou of boundless bounty.

Sanskit Text: अन्यदद्य कर्वरमन्यदु शवो.असच्च सन मुहुराचक्रिरिन्द्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anyadadya karvaramanyadu śvo.asacca san muhurācakririndraḥ |
Translation: 5 One act to-day, another act tomorrow oft Indra makes what is not yet existeni.

Sanskit Text: मित्रो नो अत्र वरुणश्च पूषार्यो वशस्य पर्येतास्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitro no atra varuṇaśca pūṣāryo vaśasya paryetāsti ||
Translation: Here have we Mitra, Varuṇa, and Pūṣan to overcome the foeman's domination.

Sanskit Text: वि तवदापो न पर्वतस्य पर्ष्ठादुक्थेभिरिन्द्रानयन्त यज्ञैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi tvadāpo na parvatasya pṛṣṭhādukthebhirindrānayanta yajñaiḥ |
Translation: 6 By song and sacrifice men brought the waters from thee, as from a mountain's ridge, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: तं तवाभिः सुष्टुतिभिर्वाजयन्त आजिं न जग्मुर्गिर्वाहो अश्वाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvābhiḥ suṣṭutibhirvājayanta ājiṃ na jaghmurghirvāho aśvāḥ ||
Translation: Urging thy might, with these fair lauds they seek thee, O theme of song, as horses rush tobattle.

Sanskit Text: न यं जरन्ति शरदो न मासा न दयाव इन्द्रमवकर्शयन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yaṃ jaranti śarado na māsā na dyāva indramavakarśayanti |
Translation: 7 That Indra whom nor months nor autumn seasons wither with age, nor fleeting days enfeeble,—

Sanskit Text: वर्द्धस्य चिद वर्धतामस्य तनू सतोमेभिरुक्थैश्चशस्यमाना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛddhasya cid vardhatāmasya tanū stomebhirukthaiścaśasyamānā ||
Translation: Still may his body Wax, e’en now so mighty, glorified by the lauds and hymns that praise him.

Sanskit Text: न वीळवे नमते न सथिराय न शर्धते दस्युजूताय सतवान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na vīḷave namate na sthirāya na śardhate dasyujūtāya stavān |
Translation: 8 Extolled, he bends not to the strong, the steadfast, nor to the bold incited by the Dasyu.

Sanskit Text: अज्रा इन्द्रस्य गिरयश्चिद रष्वा गम्भीरे चिद भवतिगाधमस्मै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajrā indrasya ghirayaścid ṛṣvā ghambhīre cid bhavatighādhamasmai ||
Translation: High mountains are as level plains to Indra: even in the deep he finds firm ground to rest on.

Sanskit Text: गम्भीरेण न उरुणामत्रिन परेषो यन्धि सुतपावन वाजान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghambhīreṇa na uruṇāmatrin preṣo yandhi sutapāvan vājān |
Translation: 9 Impetuous Speeder through all depth and distance, give strengthening food, thou drinker of the juices.

Sanskit Text: सथा ऊ षु ऊर्ध्व ऊती अरिषण्यन्नक्तोर्व्युष्टौ परितक्म्यायाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sthā ū ṣu ūrdhva ūtī ariṣaṇyannaktorvyuṣṭau paritakmyāyām ||
Translation: Stand up erect to help us, unreluctant, what time the gloom of night brightens to morning.

Sanskit Text: सचस्व नायमवसे अभीक इतो वा तमिन्द्र पाहि रिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sacasva nāyamavase abhīka ito vā tamindra pāhi riṣaḥ |
Translation: 10 Hasting to help, come hither and protect him, keep him from harm when he is here, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: अमा चैनमरण्ये पाहि रिषो मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: amā cainamaraṇye pāhi riṣo madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ ||
Translation: At home, abroad, from injury preserve him. May brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

Sanskit Text: या त ऊतिरवमा या परमा या मध्यमेन्द्र शुष्मिन्नस्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā ta ūtiravamā yā paramā yā madhyamendra śuṣminnasti |
Translation: 1. WITH thine assistance, O thou Mighty Indra, be it the least, the midmost, or the highest,—

Sanskit Text: ताभिरू षु वर्त्रहत्ये.अवीर्न एभिश्च वाजैर्महान्न उग्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tābhirū ṣu vṛtrahatye.avīrna ebhiśca vājairmahānna ughra ||
Translation: Great with those aids and by these powers support us, Strong God! in battle that subdues our foemen.

Sanskit Text: आभि सप्र्धो मिथतीररिषण्यन्नमित्रस्य वयथया मन्युमिन्द्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ābhi spṛdho mithatīrariṣaṇyannamitrasya vyathayā manyumindra |
Translation: 2 With these discomfit hosts that fight against us, and check the opponent's wrath, thyself uninjured.

Sanskit Text: आभिर्विश्वा अभियुजो विषूचीरार्याय विशो.अव तारीर्दासीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ābhirviśvā abhiyujo viṣūcīrāryāya viśo.ava tārīrdāsīḥ ||
Translation: With these chase all our foes to every quarter: subdue the tribes of Dāsas to the Ārya.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र जामय उत ये.अजामयो.अर्वाचीनासो वनुषो युयुज्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra jāmaya uta ye.ajāmayo.arvācīnāso vanuṣo yuyujre |
Translation: 3 Those who array themselves as foes to smite us, O Indra, be they kin or be they strangers,—

Sanskit Text: तवमेषां विथुरा शवांसि जहि वर्ष्ण्यानि कर्णुही पराचः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvameṣāṃ vithurā śavāṃsi jahi vṛṣṇyāni kṛṇuhī parācaḥ ||
Translation: Strike thou their manly strength that it be feeble, and drive in headlong flight our foemen backward.

Sanskit Text: शूरो वा शूरं वनते शरीरैस्तनूरुचा तरुषि यत कर्ण्वैते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śūro vā śūraṃ vanate śarīraistanūrucā taruṣi yat kṛṇvaite |
Translation: 4 With strength of limb the hero slays the hero, when bright in arms they range them for the combat.

Sanskit Text: तोके वा गोषु तनये यदप्सु वि करन्दसी उर्वरासु बरवैते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: toke vā ghoṣu tanaye yadapsu vi krandasī urvarāsu bravaite ||
Translation: When two opposing hosts contend in battle for seed and offspring, waters, kine, or corn-lands.

Sanskit Text: नहि तवा शूरो न तुरो न धर्ष्णुर्न तवा योधो मन्यमानो युयोध |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi tvā śūro na turo na dhṛṣṇurna tvā yodho manyamāno yuyodha |
Translation: 5 Yet no strong man hath conquered thee, no hero, no brave, no warrior trusting in his valour.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र नकिष टवा परत्यस्त्येषां विश्वा जातान्यभ्यसि तानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra nakiṣ ṭvā pratyastyeṣāṃ viśvā jātānyabhyasi tāni ||
Translation: Not one of these is match for thee, O Indra. Thou far surpassest all these living creatures.

Sanskit Text: स पत्यत उभयोर्न्र्म्णमयोर्यदी वेधसः समिथे हवन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa patyata ubhayornṛmṇamayoryadī vedhasaḥ samithe havante |
Translation: 6 He is the Lord of both these armies' valour when the commanders call them to the conflict:

Sanskit Text: वर्त्रे वा महो नर्वति कषये वा वयचस्वन्ता यदि वितन्तसैते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛtre vā maho nṛvati kṣaye vā vyacasvantā yadi vitantasaite ||
Translation: When with their ranks expanded they are fighting with a great foe or for a home with heroes.

Sanskit Text: अध समा ते चर्षणयो यदेजानिन्द्र तरातोत भवा वरूता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha smā te carṣaṇayo yadejānindra trātota bhavā varūtā |
Translation: 7 And when the people stir themselves for battle, be thou their saviour, Indra, and protector,

Sanskit Text: अस्माकासो ये नर्तमासो अर्य इन्द्र सूरयो दधिरे पुरोनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākāso ye nṛtamāso arya indra sūrayo dadhire puronaḥ ||
Translation: And theirs, thy manliest of our friends, the pious, the chiefs who have installed us priests, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: अनु ते दायि मह इन्द्रियाय सत्रा ते विष्वमनु वर्त्रहत्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu te dāyi maha indriyāya satrā te viṣvamanu vṛtrahatye |
Translation: 8 To thee for high dominion hath been for evermore, for slaughtering the Vṛtras,

Sanskit Text: अनु कषत्रमनु सहो यजत्रेन्द्र देवेभिरनु ते नर्षह्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu kṣatramanu saho yajatrendra devebhiranu te nṛṣahye ||
Translation: All lordly power and might, O Holy Indra, given by Gods for victory in battle.

Sanskit Text: एवा न सप्र्धः समजा समत्स्विन्द्र रारन्धि मिथतीरदेवीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā na spṛdhaḥ samajā samatsvindra rārandhi mithatīradevīḥ |
Translation: 9 So urge our hosts together in the combats: yield up the godless bands that fight against us.

Sanskit Text: विद्याम वस्तोरवसा गर्णन्तो भरद्वाजा उत त इन्द्र नूनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidyāma vastoravasā ghṛṇanto bharadvājā uta ta indra nūnam ||
Translation: Singing, at morn may we find thee with favour, yea, Indra, and e’en now, we Bharadvājas.

Sanskit Text: शरुधी न इन्द्र हवयामसि तवा महो वाजस्य सातौ वाव्र्षाणाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrudhī na indra hvayāmasi tvā maho vājasya sātau vāvṛṣāṇāḥ |
Translation: 1. O INDRA, hear us. Raining down the Soma, we call on thee to win us mighty valour.

Sanskit Text: सं यद विशो.अयन्त शूरसाता उग्रं नो.अवः पार्ये अहन दाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yad viśo.ayanta śūrasātā ughraṃ no.avaḥ pārye ahan dāḥ ||
Translation: Give us strong succour on the day of trial, when the tribes gather on the field of battle.

Sanskit Text: तवां वाजी हवते वाजिनेयो महो वाजस्य गध्यस्य सातौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ vājī havate vājineyo maho vājasya ghadhyasya sātau |
Translation: 2 The warrior, son of warrior sire, invokes thee, to gain great strength that may be won as booty:

Sanskit Text: तवां वर्त्रेष्विन्द्र सत्पतिं तरुत्रं तवां चष्टे मुष्टिहा गोषु युध्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ vṛtreṣvindra satpatiṃ tarutraṃ tvāṃ caṣṭe muṣṭihā ghoṣu yudhyan ||
Translation: To thee, the brave man's Lord, the fiends' subduer, he looks when fighting hand to hand for cattle.

Sanskit Text: तवं कविं चोदयो.अर्कसातौ तवं कुत्साय शुष्णं दाशुषे वर्क |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ kaviṃ codayo.arkasātau tvaṃ kutsāya śuṣṇaṃ dāśuṣe vark |
Translation: 3 Thou didst impel the sage to win the daylight, didst ruin Śuṣṇa for the pious Kutsa.

Sanskit Text: तवं शिरो अमर्मणः पराहन्नतिथिग्वाय शंस्यं करिष्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ śiro amarmaṇaḥ parāhannatithighvāya śaṃsyaṃ kariṣyan ||
Translation: The invulnerable demon's head thou clavest when thou wouldst win the praise of Atithigva.

Sanskit Text: तवं रथं पर भरो योधं रष्वमावो युध्यन्तं वर्षभं दशद्युम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ rathaṃ pra bharo yodhaṃ ṛṣvamāvo yudhyantaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ daśadyum |
Translation: 4 The lofty battle-car thou broughtest forward; thou holpest Dasadyu the strong when fighting.

Sanskit Text: तवं तुग्रं वेतसवे सचाहन तवं तुजिं गर्णन्तमिन्द्र तूतोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tughraṃ vetasave sacāhan tvaṃ tujiṃ ghṛṇantamindra tūtoḥ ||
Translation: Along with Vetasu thou slewest Tugra, and madest Tuji strong, who praised thee, Indra.

Sanskit Text: तवं तदुक्थमिन्द्र बर्हणा कः पर यच्छता सहस्राशूर दर्षि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tadukthamindra barhaṇā kaḥ pra yacchatā sahasrāśūra darṣi |
Translation: 5 Thou madest good the laud, what time thou rentest a hundred thousand fighting foes, O Hero,

Sanskit Text: अव गिरेर्दासं शम्बरं हन परावो दिवोदासं चित्राभिरूती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava ghirerdāsaṃ śambaraṃ han prāvo divodāsaṃ citrābhirūtī ||
Translation: Slewest the Dāsa Śambara of the mountain, and with strange aids didst succour Divodāsa.

Sanskit Text: तवं शरद्धाभिर्मन्दसानः सोमैर्दभीतये चुमुरिमिन्द्रसिष्वप |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ śraddhābhirmandasānaḥ somairdabhītaye cumurimindrasiṣvap |
Translation: 6 Made glad with Soma-draughts and faith, thou sentest Cumuri to his sleep, to please Dabhīti.

Sanskit Text: तवं रजिं पिठीनसे दशस्यन षष्टिं सहस्राशच्या सचाहन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ rajiṃ piṭhīnase daśasyan ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrāśacyā sacāhan ||
Translation: Thou, kindly giving Raji to Pithinas, slewest with might, at once, the sixty thousand.

Sanskit Text: अहं चन तत सूरिभिरानश्यां तव जयाय इन्द्र सुम्नमोजः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ cana tat sūribhirānaśyāṃ tava jyāya indra sumnamojaḥ |
Translation: 7 May I too, with the liberal chiefs, O Indra, acquire thy blin supreme and domination,

Sanskit Text: तवया यत सतवन्ते सधवीर वीरास्त्रिवरूथेन नहुषा शविष्ठ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā yat stavante sadhavīra vīrāstrivarūthena nahuṣā śaviṣṭha ||
Translation: When, Mightiest! Hero-girt! Nahuṣa heroes boast them in thee, the triply-strong Defender.

Sanskit Text: वयं ते अस्यामिन्द्र दयुम्नहूतौ सखायः सयाम महिन परेष्ठाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ te asyāmindra dyumnahūtau sakhāyaḥ syāma mahina preṣṭhāḥ |
Translation: 8 So may we he thy friends, thy best beloved, O Indra, at this holy invocation.

Sanskit Text: परातर्दनिः कषत्रश्रीरस्तु शरेष्ठो घने वर्त्राणां सनये धनानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātardaniḥ kṣatraśrīrastu śreṣṭho ghane vṛtrāṇāṃ sanaye dhanānām ||
Translation: Best be Pratardani, illustrious ruler, in slaying foemen and in gaining riches.

Sanskit Text: किमस्य मदे किं वस्य पीताविन्द्रः किमस्य सख्ये चकार |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kimasya made kiṃ vasya pītāvindraḥ kimasya sakhye cakāra |
Translation: 1 WHAT deed hath Indra done in the wild transport, in quaffing or in friendship with, the Soma?

Sanskit Text: रणा वा ये निषदि किं ते अस्य पुर विविद्रे किमु नूतनासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: raṇā vā ye niṣadi kiṃ te asya pura vividre kimu nūtanāsaḥ ||
Translation: What joys have men of ancient times or recent obtained within the chamber of libation?

Sanskit Text: सदस्य मदे सद वस्य पितविन्द्रः सदस्य सख्ये चकार |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadasya made sad vasya pitavindraḥ sadasya sakhye cakāra |
Translation: 2 In its wild joy Indra hath proved him faithful, faithful in quaffing, faithful in its friendship.

Sanskit Text: रणा वा ये निषदि सत ते अस्य पुर विविद्रे सदु नूतनासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: raṇā vā ye niṣadi sat te asya pura vividre sadu nūtanāsaḥ ||
Translation: His truth is the delight that in this chamber the men of old and recent times have tasted.

Sanskit Text: नहि नु ते महिमनः समस्य न मघवन मघवत्त्वस्य विद्म |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi nu te mahimanaḥ samasya na maghavan maghavattvasya vidma |
Translation: 3 All thy vast power, O Maghavan, we know not, know not the riches of thy full abundance.

Sanskit Text: न राधसो-राधसो नूतनस्येन्द्र नकिर्दद्र्श इन्द्रियं ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na rādhaso-rādhaso nūtanasyendra nakirdadṛśa indriyaṃ te ||
Translation: No one hath seen that might of thine, productive of bounty every day renewed, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: एतत तयत त इन्द्रियमचेति येनावधीर्वरशिखस्य शेषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etat tyat ta indriyamaceti yenāvadhīrvaraśikhasya śeṣaḥ |
Translation: 4 This one great power of thine our eyes have witnessed, wherewith thou slewest Varasikha's children,

Sanskit Text: वज्रस्य यत ते निहतस्य शुष्मात सवनाच्चिदिन्द्र परमोददार ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vajrasya yat te nihatasya śuṣmāt svanāccidindra paramodadāra ||
Translation: When by the force of thy descending thunder, at the mere solund, their boldest was demolished.

Sanskit Text: वधीदिन्द्रो वरशिखस्य शेषो.अभ्यावर्तिने चायमानाय शिक्षन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vadhīdindro varaśikhasya śeṣo.abhyāvartine cāyamānāya śikṣan |
Translation: 5 In aid of Abhyavartin Cayamana, Indra destroyed the seed of Varasikha.

Sanskit Text: वर्चीवतो यद धरियूपीयायां हन पूर्वे अर्धे भियसापरो दर्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛcīvato yad dhariyūpīyāyāṃ han pūrve ardhe bhiyasāparo dart ||
Translation: At Hariyupiya he smote the vanguard of the Vrcivans, and the rear fled frighted.

Sanskit Text: तरिंशच्छतं वर्मिण इन्द्र साकं यव्यावत्यां पुरुहूत शरवस्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: triṃśacchataṃ varmiṇa indra sākaṃ yavyāvatyāṃ puruhūta śravasyā |
Translation: 6 Three thousand, mailed, in quest of fame, together, on the Yavyavati, O much-sought Indra,

Sanskit Text: वर्चीवन्तः शरवे पत्यमानाः पात्रा भिन्दानन्यर्थान्यायन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛcīvantaḥ śarave patyamānāḥ pātrā bhindānanyarthānyāyan ||
Translation: Vrcivan's sons, falling before the arrow, like bursting vessels went to their destruction.

Sanskit Text: यस्य गावावरुषा सूयवस्यू अन्तरू षु चरतो रेरिहाणा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya ghāvāvaruṣā sūyavasyū antarū ṣu carato rerihāṇā |
Translation: 7 He, whose two red Steers, seeking goodly pasture, plying their tongues move on 'twixt earth and heaven,

Sanskit Text: स सर्ञ्जयाय तुर्वशं परादाद वर्चीवतो दैववातायशिक्षन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sṛñjayāya turvaśaṃ parādād vṛcīvato daivavātāyaśikṣan ||
Translation: Gave Turvaśa to Sṛñjaya, and, to aid him, gave the Vrcivans up to Daivavata.

Sanskit Text: दवयानग्ने रथिनो विंशतिं गा वधूमतो मघवा मह्यं सम्राट |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvayānaghne rathino viṃśatiṃ ghā vadhūmato maghavā mahyaṃ samrāṭ |
Translation: 8 Two wagon-teams, with damsels, twenty oxen, O Agni, Abhydvartin Cayamdna,

Sanskit Text: अभ्यावर्ती चायमानो ददाति दूणाशेयं दक्षिणा पार्थवानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhyāvartī cāyamāno dadāti dūṇāśeyaṃ dakṣiṇā pārthavānām ||
Translation: The liberal Sovran, giveth me. This guerdon of Prthu's seed is hard to win from others.

Sanskit Text: आ गावो अग्मन्नुत भद्रमक्रन सीदन्तु गोष्ठे रणयन्त्वस्मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ghāvo aghmannuta bhadramakran sīdantu ghoṣṭhe raṇayantvasme |
Translation: 1. THE Kine have come and brought good fortune: let them rest in the cow-pen and be happy near us.

Sanskit Text: परजावतीः पुरुरूपा इह सयुरिन्द्राय पूर्वीरुषसो दुहानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prajāvatīḥ pururūpā iha syurindrāya pūrvīruṣaso duhānāḥ ||
Translation: Here let them stay prolific, many-coloured, and yield through many morns their milk for Indra.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो यज्वने पर्णते च शिक्षत्युपेद ददाति न सवं मुषायति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro yajvane pṛṇate ca śikṣatyuped dadāti na svaṃ muṣāyati |
Translation: 2 Indra aids him who offers sacrifice and gifts: he takes not what is his, and gives him more thereto.

Sanskit Text: भूयो-भूयो रयिमिदस्य वर्धयन्नभिन्ने खिल्ये निदधाति देवयुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūyo-bhūyo rayimidasya vardhayannabhinne khilye nidadhāti devayum ||
Translation: Increasing ever more and ever more his wealth, he makes the pious dwell within unbroken bounds.

Sanskit Text: न ता नशन्ति न दभाति तस्करो नासामामित्रो वयथिरादधर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na tā naśanti na dabhāti taskaro nāsāmāmitro vyathirādadharṣati |
Translation: 3 These are ne’er lost, no robber ever injures them: no evil-minded foe attempts to harass them.

Sanskit Text: देवांश्च याभिर्यजते ददाति च जयोगित ताभिः सचते गोपतिः सह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāṃśca yābhiryajate dadāti ca jyoghit tābhiḥ sacate ghopatiḥ saha ||
Translation: The master of the Kine lives many a year with these, the Cows whereby he pours his gifts and serves the Gods.

Sanskit Text: न ता अर्वा रेणुककाटो अश्नुते न संस्क्र्तत्रमुप यन्ति ता अभि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na tā arvā reṇukakāṭo aśnute na saṃskṛtatramupa yanti tā abhi |
Translation: 4 The charger with his dusty brow o’ertakes them not, and never to the shambles do they take their way.

Sanskit Text: उरुगायमभयं तस्य ता अनु गावो मर्तस्य विचरन्ति यज्वनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: urughāyamabhayaṃ tasya tā anu ghāvo martasya vicaranti yajvanaḥ ||
Translation: These Cows, the cattle of the pious worshipper, roam over widespread pasture where no danger is.

Sanskit Text: गावो भगो गाव इन्द्रो मे अछान गावः सोमस्य परथमस्य भक्षः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāvo bhagho ghāva indro me achān ghāvaḥ somasya prathamasya bhakṣaḥ |
Translation: 5 To me the Cows seem Bhaga, they seem Indra, they seem a portion of the first-poured Soma.

Sanskit Text: इमा या गावः स जनास इन्द्र इछामीद धर्दामनसा चिदिन्द्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā yā ghāvaḥ sa janāsa indra ichāmīd dhṛdāmanasā cidindram ||
Translation: These present Cows, they, O ye Indra. I long for Indra with my heart and spirit.

Sanskit Text: यूयं गावो मेदयथा कर्शं चिदश्रीरं चित कर्णुथा सुप्रतीकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyaṃ ghāvo medayathā kṛśaṃ cidaśrīraṃ cit kṛṇuthā supratīkam |
Translation: 6 O Cows, ye fatten e’en the worn and wasted, and make the unlovely beautiful tolook on.

Sanskit Text: भद्रं गर्हं कर्णुथ भद्रवाचो बर्हद वो वय उच्यते सभासु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadraṃ ghṛhaṃ kṛṇutha bhadravāco bṛhad vo vaya ucyate sabhāsu ||
Translation: Prosper my house, ye with auspicious voices. Your power is glorified in our assemblies.

Sanskit Text: परजावतीः सूयवसं रिशन्तीः शुद्धा अपः सुप्रपाणेपिबन्तीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prajāvatīḥ sūyavasaṃ riśantīḥ śuddhā apaḥ suprapāṇepibantīḥ |
Translation: 7 Crop goodly pasturage and be prolific drink pure sweet water at good drinking places.

Sanskit Text: मा व सतेन ईशत माघशंसः परि वो हेती रुद्रस्य वर्ज्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā va stena īśata māghaśaṃsaḥ pari vo hetī rudrasya vṛjyāḥ ||
Translation: Never be thief or sinful man your matter, and may the dart of Rudra still avoid you.

Sanskit Text: उपेदमुपपर्चनमासु गोषूप पर्च्यताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upedamupaparcanamāsu ghoṣūpa pṛcyatām |
Translation: 8 Now let this close admixture be close intermigled with these Cows,

Sanskit Text: उप रषभस्य रेतस्युपेन्द्र तव वीर्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa ṛṣabhasya retasyupendra tava vīrye ||
Translation: Mixt with the Steer's prolific flow, and, Indra, with thy hero might.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं वो नरः सख्याय सेपुर्महो यन्तः सुमतये चकानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ vo naraḥ sakhyāya sepurmaho yantaḥ sumataye cakānāḥ |
Translation: 1. YOUR men have followed Indra for his friendship, and for his loving-kindness glorified him.

Sanskit Text: महो हि दाता वज्रहस्तो अस्ति महामु रण्वमवसे यजध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maho hi dātā vajrahasto asti mahāmu raṇvamavase yajadhvam ||
Translation: For he bestows great wealth, the Thunder-wielder: worship him, Great and Kind, to win his favour.

Sanskit Text: आ यस्मिन हस्ते नर्या मिमिक्षुरा रथे हिरण्यये रथेष्ठाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yasmin haste naryā mimikṣurā rathe hiraṇyaye ratheṣṭhāḥ |
Translation: 2 Him to whose hand, men closely cling, and drivers stand on his golden chariot firmly stationed.

Sanskit Text: आ रश्मयो गभस्त्यो सथूरयोराध्वन्नश्वासो वर्षणो युजानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā raśmayo ghabhastyo sthūrayorādhvannaśvāso vṛṣaṇo yujānāḥ ||
Translation: With his firm arms he holds the reins; his Horses, the Stallions, are yoked ready for the journey.

Sanskit Text: शरिये ते पादा दुव आ मिमिक्षुर्ध्र्ष्णुर्वज्री शवसा दक्षिणावान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śriye te pādā duva ā mimikṣurdhṛṣṇurvajrī śavasā dakṣiṇāvān |
Translation: 3 Thy devotees embrace thy feet for glory. Bold, thunder-armed, rich, through thy strength, in guerdon,

Sanskit Text: वसानो अत्कं सुरभिं दर्शे कं सवर्ण नर्तविषिरो बभूथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasāno atkaṃ surabhiṃ dṛśe kaṃ svarṇa nṛtaviṣiro babhūtha ||
Translation: Robed in a garment fair as heaven to look on, thou hast displayed thee like an active dancer.

Sanskit Text: स सोम आमिश्लतमः सुतो भूद यस्मिन पक्तिः पच्यते सन्तिधानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa soma āmiślatamaḥ suto bhūd yasmin paktiḥ pacyate santidhānāḥ |
Translation: 4 That Soma when effused hath best consistence, for which the food is dressed and grain is mingled;

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं नर सतुवन्तो बरह्मकारा उक्था शंसन्तो देववाततमाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ nara stuvanto brahmakārā ukthā śaṃsanto devavātatamāḥ ||
Translation: By which the men who pray, extolling Indra chief favourites of Gods, recite their praises.

Sanskit Text: न ते अन्तः शवसो धाय्यस्य वि तु बाबधे रोदसी महित्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na te antaḥ śavaso dhāyyasya vi tu bābadhe rodasī mahitvā |
Translation: 5 No limit of thy might hath been appointed, which by its greatness sundered earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: आ ता सूरिः पर्णति तूतुजानो यूथेवाप्सु समीजमान ऊती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tā sūriḥ pṛṇati tūtujāno yūthevāpsu samījamāna ūtī ||
Translation: These the Prince filleth full with strong endeavour, driving, as ’twere, with help his flocks to waters.

Sanskit Text: एवेदिन्द्रः सुहव रष्वो अस्तूती अनूती हिरिशिप्रः सत्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evedindraḥ suhava ṛṣvo astūtī anūtī hiriśipraḥ satvā |
Translation: 6 So be the lofty Indra prompt to listen, Helper unaided, golden-visored Hero.

Sanskit Text: एवा हि जातो असमात्योजाः पुरू च वर्त्रा हनति नि दस्यून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā hi jāto asamātyojāḥ purū ca vṛtrā hanati ni dasyūn ||
Translation: Yea, so may he, shown forth in might unequalled, smite down the many Vṛtras and the Dasyus.

Sanskit Text: भूय इद वाव्र्धे वीर्यायनेको अजुर्यो दयते वसूनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūya id vāvṛdhe vīryāyaneko ajuryo dayate vasūni |
Translation: 1. INDRA hath waxed yet more for hero prowess, alone, Eternal, he bestoweth treasures.

Sanskit Text: पर रिरिचे दिव इन्द्रः पर्थिव्या अर्धमिदस्य परति रोदसी उभे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ririce diva indraḥ pṛthivyā ardhamidasya prati rodasī ubhe ||
Translation: Indra transcendeth both the worlds in greatness: one half of him equalleth earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: अधा मन्ये बर्हदसुर्यमस्य यानि दाधार नकिरा मिनाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā manye bṛhadasuryamasya yāni dādhāra nakirā mināti |
Translation: 2 Yea, mighty I esteem his Godlike nature: none hindereth what he hath once determined.

Sanskit Text: दिवे-दिवे सूर्यो दर्शतो भूद वि सद्मान्युर्विया सुक्रतुर्धात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dive-dive sūryo darśato bhūd vi sadmānyurviyā sukraturdhāt ||
Translation: Near and afar he spread and set the regions, and every day the Sun became apparent.

Sanskit Text: अद्या चिन नू चित तदपो नदीनां यदाभ्यो अरदो गातुमिन्द्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adyā cin nū cit tadapo nadīnāṃ yadābhyo arado ghātumindra |
Translation: 3 E’en now endures thine exploit of the Rivers, when, Indra, for their floods thou clavest passage.

Sanskit Text: नि पर्वता अद्मसदो न सेदुस्त्वया दर्ळ्हानि सुक्रतो रजांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni parvatā admasado na sedustvayā dṛḷhāni sukrato rajāṃsi ||
Translation: Like men who sit at meat the mountains settled: by thee, Most Wise! the regions were made steadfast.

Sanskit Text: सत्यमित तन न तवावानन्यो अस्तीन्द्र देवो न मर्त्यो जयायान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satyamit tan na tvāvānanyo astīndra devo na martyo jyāyān |
Translation: 4 This is the truth, none else is like thee, Indra, no God superior to thee, no mortal.

Sanskit Text: अहन्नहिं परिशयानमर्णो.अवास्र्जो अपो अछा समुद्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahannahiṃ pariśayānamarṇo.avāsṛjo apo achā samudram ||
Translation: Thou slewest Ahi who besieged the waters, and lettest loose the streams to hurry seaward.

Sanskit Text: तवमपो वि दुरो विषूचीरिन्द्र दर्ळ्हमरुजः पर्वतस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamapo vi duro viṣūcīrindra dṛḷhamarujaḥ parvatasya |
Translation: 5 Indra, thou breakest up the floods and portals on all sides, and the firmness of the mountain.

Sanskit Text: राजाभवो जगतश्चर्षणीनां साकं सूर्यं जनयन दयामुषासम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājābhavo jaghataścarṣaṇīnāṃ sākaṃ sūryaṃ janayan dyāmuṣāsam ||
Translation: Thou art the King of men, of all that liveth, engendering at once Sun, Heaven, and Morning.

Sanskit Text: अभूरेको रयिपते रयीणामा हस्तयोरधिथा इन्द्र कर्ष्टीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhūreko rayipate rayīṇāmā hastayoradhithā indra kṛṣṭīḥ |
Translation: 1. SOLE Lord of wealth art thou, O Lord of riches: thou in thine hands hast held the people, Indra!

Sanskit Text: वि तोके अप्सु तनये च सूरे.अवोचन्त चर्षणयो विवाचः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi toke apsu tanaye ca sūre.avocanta carṣaṇayo vivācaḥ ||
Translation: Men have invoked thee with contending voices for seed and waters, progeny and sunlight.

Sanskit Text: तवद भियेन्द्र पार्थिवानि विश्वाच्युता चिच्च्यावयन्ते रजांसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvad bhiyendra pārthivāni viśvācyutā ciccyāvayante rajāṃsi |
Translation: 2 Through fear of thee, O Indra, all the regions of earth, though naught may move them, shake and tremble.

Sanskit Text: दयावाक्षामा पर्वतासो वनानि विश्वं दर्ळ्हं भयते अज्मन्ना ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyāvākṣāmā parvatāso vanāni viśvaṃ dṛḷhaṃ bhayate ajmannā te ||
Translation: All that is firm is frightened at thy coming, -the earth, the heaven, the mountain, and the forest.

Sanskit Text: तवं कुत्सेनाभि शुष्णमिन्द्राशुषं युध्य कुयवं गविष्टौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ kutsenābhi śuṣṇamindrāśuṣaṃ yudhya kuyavaṃ ghaviṣṭau |
Translation: 3 With Kutsa, Indra! thou didst conquer Śuṣṇa, voracious, bane of crops, in fight for cattle.

Sanskit Text: दश परपित्वे अध सूर्यस्य मुषायश्चक्रमविवेरपांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśa prapitve adha sūryasya muṣāyaścakramaviverapāṃsi ||
Translation: In the close fray thou rentest him: thou stolest the Sun's wheel and didst drive away misfortunes.

Sanskit Text: तवं शतान्यव शम्बरस्य पुरो जघन्थाप्रतीनि सस्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ śatānyava śambarasya puro jaghanthāpratīni sasyoḥ |
Translation: 4 Thou smotest to the ground the hundred castles, impregnable, of Śambara the Dasyu,

Sanskit Text: अशिक्षो यत्र शच्या शचीवो दिवोदासाय सुन्वते सुतक्रे भरद्वाजाय गर्णते वसूनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśikṣo yatra śacyā śacīvo divodāsāya sunvate sutakre bharadvājāya ghṛṇate vasūni ||
Translation: When, Strong, with might thou holpest Divodāsa who poured libations out, O Soma-buyer, and madest Bharadvāja rich who praised thee.

Sanskit Text: स सत्यसत्वन महते रणाय रथमा तिष्ठ तुविन्र्म्ण भीमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa satyasatvan mahate raṇāya rathamā tiṣṭha tuvinṛmṇa bhīmam |
Translation: 5 As such, true Hero, for great joy of battle mount thy terrific car, O Brave and Manly.

Sanskit Text: याहि परपथिन्नवसोप मद्रिक पर च शरुत शरावय चर्षणिभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāhi prapathinnavasopa madrik pra ca śruta śrāvaya carṣaṇibhyaḥ ||
Translation: Come with thine help to me, thou distant Roamer, and, glorious God, spread among men my glory.

Sanskit Text: अपूर्व्या पुरुतमान्यस्मै महे वीराय तवसे तुराय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apūrvyā purutamānyasmai mahe vīrāya tavase turāya |
Translation: 1. I WITH my lips have fashioned for this Hero words never matched, most plentiful and auspicious,

Sanskit Text: विरप्शिने वज्रिणे शन्तमानि वचांस्यासा सथविराय तक्षम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: virapśine vajriṇe śantamāni vacāṃsyāsā sthavirāya takṣam ||
Translation: For him the Ancient, Great, Strong, Energetic, the very mighty Wielder of the Thunder.

Sanskit Text: स मातरा सूर्येणा कवीनामवासयद रुजदद्रिं गर्णानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa mātarā sūryeṇā kavīnāmavāsayad rujadadriṃ ghṛṇānaḥ |
Translation: 2 Amid the sages, with the Sun he brightened the Parents: glorified, he burst the mountain;

Sanskit Text: सवाधीभिर्र्क्वभिर्वावशान उदुस्रियाणामस्र्जन निदानम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svādhībhirṛkvabhirvāvaśāna udusriyāṇāmasṛjan nidānam ||
Translation: And, roaring with the holy-thoughted singers, he loosed the bond that held the beams of Morning.

Sanskit Text: स वह्निभिर्र्क्वभिर्गोषु शश्वन मितज्ञुभिः पुरुक्र्त्वा जिगाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vahnibhirṛkvabhirghoṣu śaśvan mitajñubhiḥ purukṛtvā jighāya |
Translation: 3 Famed for great deeds, with priests who kneel and laud him, he still hath conquered in the frays for cattle,

Sanskit Text: पुरः पुरोहा सखिभिः सखीयन दर्ळ्हा रुरोज कविभिः कविः सन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: puraḥ purohā sakhibhiḥ sakhīyan dṛḷhā ruroja kavibhiḥ kaviḥ san ||
Translation: And broken down the forts, the Fort-destroyer, a Friend with friends, a Sage among the sages.

Sanskit Text: स नीव्याभिर्जरितारमछा महो वाजेभिर्महद्भिश्च शुष्मैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa nīvyābhirjaritāramachā maho vājebhirmahadbhiśca śuṣmaiḥ |
Translation: 4 Come with thy girthed mares, with abundant vigour and plenteous strength to him who sings thy praises.

Sanskit Text: पुरुवीराभिर्व्र्षभ कषितीनामा गिर्वणः सुविताय पर याहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: puruvīrābhirvṛṣabha kṣitīnāmā ghirvaṇaḥ suvitāya pra yāhi ||
Translation: Come hither, borne by mares with many heroes, Lover of song! Steer! for the people's welfare.

Sanskit Text: स सर्गेण शवसा तक्तो अत्यैरप इन्द्रो दक्षिणतस्तुराषाट |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sargheṇa śavasā takto atyairapa indro dakṣiṇatasturāṣāṭ |
Translation: 5 Indra with rush and might, sped by his Coursers, hath swiftly won the waters from the southward.

Sanskit Text: इत्था सर्जाना अनपाव्र्दर्थं दिवे-दिवे विविषुरप्रम्र्ष्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: itthā sṛjānā anapāvṛdarthaṃ dive-dive viviṣurapramṛṣyam ||
Translation: Thus set at liberty the rivers daily flow to their goal, incessant and exhaustless.

Sanskit Text: य ओजिष्ठ इन्द्र तं सु नो दा मदो वर्षन सवभिष्टिर्दास्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya ojiṣṭha indra taṃ su no dā mado vṛṣan svabhiṣṭirdāsvān |
Translation: 1. GIVE us the rapture that is mightiest, Indra, prompt to bestow and swift to aid, O Hero,

Sanskit Text: सौवश्व्यं यो वनवत सवश्वो वर्त्रा समत्सु सासहदमित्रान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sauvaśvyaṃ yo vanavat svaśvo vṛtrā samatsu sāsahadamitrān ||
Translation: That wins with brave steeds where brave steeds encounter, and quells the Vṛtras and the foes in battle.

Sanskit Text: तवां हीन्द्रावसे विवाचो हवन्ते चर्षणयः शूरसातौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ hīndrāvase vivāco havante carṣaṇayaḥ śūrasātau |
Translation: 2 For with loud voice the tribes invoke thee, Indra, to aid them in the battlefield of heroes.

Sanskit Text: तवं विप्रेभिर्वि पणीन्रशायस्त्वोत इत सनिता वाजमर्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ viprebhirvi paṇīnraśāyastvota it sanitā vājamarvā ||
Translation: Thou, with the singers, hast pierced through the Paṇis: the charger whom thou aidest wins the booty.

Sanskit Text: तवं तानिन्द्रोभयानमित्रान दासा वर्त्राण्यार्या च शूर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tānindrobhayānamitrān dāsā vṛtrāṇyāryā ca śūra |
Translation: 3 Both races, Indra, of opposing foemen, O Hero, both the Ārya and the Dāsa,

Sanskit Text: वधीर्वनेव सुधितेभिरत्कैरा पर्त्सु दर्षि नर्णां नर्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vadhīrvaneva sudhitebhiratkairā pṛtsu darṣi nṛṇāṃ nṛtama ||
Translation: Hast thou struck down like woods with well-shot lightnings: thou rentest them in fight, most manly Chieftain!

Sanskit Text: स तवं न इन्द्राकवाभिरूती सखा विश्वायुरविता वर्धे भूः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvaṃ na indrākavābhirūtī sakhā viśvāyuravitā vṛdhe bhūḥ |
Translation: 4 Indra, befriend us with no scanty succour, prosper and aid us, Loved of all that liveth,

Sanskit Text: सवर्षाता यद धवयामसि तवा युध्यन्तो नेमधिताप्र्त्सु शूर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svarṣātā yad dhvayāmasi tvā yudhyanto nemadhitāpṛtsu śūra ||
Translation: When, fighting for the sunlight, we invoke thee, O Hero, in the fray, in war's division.

Sanskit Text: नूनं न इन्द्रापराय च सया भवा मर्ळीक उत नो अभिष्टौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nūnaṃ na indrāparāya ca syā bhavā mṛḷīka uta no abhiṣṭau |
Translation: 5 Be ours, O Indra, now and for the future, be graciously inclined and near to help us.

Sanskit Text: इत्था गर्णन्तो महिनस्य शर्मन दिवि षयाम पार्ये गोषतमाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: itthā ghṛṇanto mahinasya śarman divi ṣyāma pārye ghoṣatamāḥ ||
Translation: Thus may we, singing, sheltered by the Mighty, win many cattle on the day of trial.

Sanskit Text: सं च तवे जग्मुर्गिर इन्द्र पूर्वीर्वि च तवद यन्ति विभ्वोमनीषाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ ca tve jaghmurghira indra pūrvīrvi ca tvad yanti vibhvomanīṣāḥ |
Translation: 1. FULL Many songs have met in thee, O Indra, and many a noble thought from thee proceedeth.

Sanskit Text: पूरा नूनं च सतुतय रषीणां पस्प्र्ध्र इन्द्रे अध्युक्थार्का ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrā nūnaṃ ca stutaya ṛṣīṇāṃ paspṛdhra indre adhyukthārkā ||
Translation: Now and of old the eulogies of sages, their holy hymns and lauds, have yearned for Indra.

Sanskit Text: पुरुहूतो यः पुरुगूर्त रभ्वानेकः पुरुप्रशस्तो अस्ति यज्ञैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: puruhūto yaḥ purughūrta ṛbhvānekaḥ purupraśasto asti yajñaiḥ |
Translation: 2 He, praised of many, bold, invoked of many, alone is glorified at sacrifices.

Sanskit Text: रथो न महे शवसे युजानो.अस्माभिरिन्द्रो अनुमाद्यो भूत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ratho na mahe śavase yujāno.asmābhirindro anumādyo bhūt ||
Translation: Like a car harnessed for some great achievement, Indra must be the cause of our rejoicing.

Sanskit Text: न यं हिंसन्ति धीतयो न वाणीरिन्द्रं नक्षन्तीदभि वर्धयन्तीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yaṃ hiṃsanti dhītayo na vāṇīrindraṃ nakṣantīdabhi vardhayantīḥ |
Translation: 3 They make their way to Indra and exalt him, bim whom no prayers and no laudations trouble;

Sanskit Text: यदि सतोतारः शतं यत सहस्रं गर्णन्ति गिर्वणसं शं तदस्मै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadi stotāraḥ śataṃ yat sahasraṃ ghṛṇanti ghirvaṇasaṃ śaṃ tadasmai ||
Translation: For when a hundred or a thousand singers. laud him who loves the song their praise delights him.

Sanskit Text: अस्मा एतद दिव्यर्चेव मासा मिमिक्ष इन्द्रे नययामि सोमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmā etad divyarceva māsā mimikṣa indre nyayāmi somaḥ |
Translation: 4 As brightness mingles with the Moon in heaven, the offered Soma yearns to mix with Indra.

Sanskit Text: जनं न धन्वन्नभि सं यदापः सत्रा वाव्र्धुर्हवनानि यज्ञैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: janaṃ na dhanvannabhi saṃ yadāpaḥ satrā vāvṛdhurhavanāni yajñaiḥ ||
Translation: Like water brought to men in desert places, our gifts at sacrifice have still refreshed him.

Sanskit Text: अस्मा एतन मह्याङगूषमस्मा इन्द्राय सतोत्रं मतिभिरवाचि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmā etan mahyāṅghūṣamasmā indrāya stotraṃ matibhiravāci |
Translation: 5 To him this mighty eulogy, to Indra hath this our laud been uttered by the poets,

Sanskit Text: असद यथा महति वर्त्रतूर्य इन्द्रो विश्वायुरविता वर्धश्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asad yathā mahati vṛtratūrya indro viśvāyuravitā vṛdhaśca ||
Translation: That in the great encounter with the foemen, Loved of all life, Indra may guard and help us.

Sanskit Text: कदा भुवन रथक्षयाणि बरह्म कदा सतोत्रे सहस्रपोष्यन्दाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadā bhuvan rathakṣayāṇi brahma kadā stotre sahasrapoṣyandāḥ |
Translation: 1. WHEN shall our prayers rest in thy car beside thee? When dost thou give the singer food for thousands?

Sanskit Text: कदा सतोमं वासयो.अस्य राया कदा धियः करसि वाजरत्नाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadā stomaṃ vāsayo.asya rāyā kadā dhiyaḥ karasi vājaratnāḥ ||
Translation: When wilt thou clothe this poet's laud with plenty, and when wilt thou enrich our hymns with booty?

Sanskit Text: कर्हि सवित तदिन्द्र यन नर्भिर्नॄन वीरैर्वीरान नीळयासे जयाजीन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: karhi svit tadindra yan nṛbhirnṝn vīrairvīrān nīḷayāse jayājīn |
Translation: 2 When wilt thou gatber men with men, O Indra, heroes with heroes, and prevail in combat?

Sanskit Text: तरिधातु गा अधि जयासि गोष्विन्द्र दयुम्नंस्वर्वद धेह्यस्मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tridhātu ghā adhi jayāsi ghoṣvindra dyumnaṃsvarvad dhehyasme ||
Translation: Thou shalt win triply kine in frays for cattle, so, Indra, give thou us celestial glory.

Sanskit Text: कर्हि सवित तदिन्द्र यज्जरित्रे विष्वप्सु बरह्म कर्णवः शविष्ठ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: karhi svit tadindra yajjaritre viṣvapsu brahma kṛṇavaḥ śaviṣṭha |
Translation: 3 Yea, when wilt thou, O Indra, thou Most Mighty, make the prayer all-sustaining for the singer?

Sanskit Text: कदा धियो न नियुतो युवासे कदा गोमघा हवनानि गछाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadā dhiyo na niyuto yuvāse kadā ghomaghā havanāni ghachāḥ ||
Translation: When wilt thou yoke, as we yoke songs, thy Horses, and come to offerings that bring wealth in cattle?

Sanskit Text: स गोमघा जरित्रे अश्वश्चन्द्रा वाजश्रवसो अधि धेहि पर्क्षः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ghomaghā jaritre aśvaścandrā vājaśravaso adhi dhehi pṛkṣaḥ |
Translation: 4 Grant to the Singer food with store of cattle, splendid with horses and the fame of riches.

Sanskit Text: पीपिहीषः सुदुघामिन्द्र धेनुं भरद्वाजेषु सुरुचो रुरुच्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pīpihīṣaḥ sudughāmindra dhenuṃ bharadvājeṣu suruco rurucyāḥ ||
Translation: Send food to swell the milch-cow good at milking: bright be its shine among the Bharadvājas.

Sanskit Text: तमा नूनं वर्जनमन्यथा चिच्छूरो यच्छक्र वि दुरोग्र्णीषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamā nūnaṃ vṛjanamanyathā cicchūro yacchakra vi duroghṛṇīṣe |
Translation: 5 Lead otherwise this present foeman, Śakra! Hence art thou praised as Hero, foe destroyer

Sanskit Text: मा निररं शुक्रदुघस्य धेनोराङगिरसान बरह्मणा विप्र जिन्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā niraraṃ śukradughasya dhenorāṅghirasān brahmaṇā vipra jinva ||
Translation: Him who gives pure gifts may I praise unceasing. Sage, quicken the Aṅgirases by devotion.

Sanskit Text: सत्रा मदासस्तव विश्वजन्याः सत्रा रायो.अध ये पार्थिवासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satrā madāsastava viśvajanyāḥ satrā rāyo.adha ye pārthivāsaḥ |
Translation: 1. THY raptures ever were for all men's profit: so evermore have been thine earthly riches.

Sanskit Text: सत्रा वाजानामभवो विभक्ता यद देवेषु धारयथा असुर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satrā vājānāmabhavo vibhaktā yad deveṣu dhārayathā asuryam ||
Translation: Thou still hast been the dealer-forth of vigour, since among Gods thou hast had power and Godhead.

Sanskit Text: अनु पर येजे जन ओजो अस्य सत्रा दधिरे अनु वीर्याय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu pra yeje jana ojo asya satrā dadhire anu vīryāya |
Translation: 2 Men have obtained his strength by sacrificing, and ever urged him, on to hero valour.

Sanskit Text: सयूमग्र्भे दुधये.अर्वते च करतुं वर्ञ्जन्त्यपि वर्त्रहत्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: syūmaghṛbhe dudhaye.arvate ca kratuṃ vṛñjantyapi vṛtrahatye ||
Translation: For the rein-seizing, the impetuous Charger they furnished power even for Vṛtra's slaughter.

Sanskit Text: तं सध्रीचीरूतयो वर्ष्ण्यानि पौंस्यानि नियुतः सश्चुरिन्द्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ sadhrīcīrūtayo vṛṣṇyāni pauṃsyāni niyutaḥ saścurindram |
Translation: 3 Associate with him, as teams of horses, help, manly might, and vigour follow Indra.

Sanskit Text: समुद्रं न सिन्धव उक्थशुष्मा उरुव्यचसं गिरा विशन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samudraṃ na sindhava ukthaśuṣmā uruvyacasaṃ ghiraā viśanti ||
Translation: As rivers reach the sea, so, strong with praises, our holy songs reach him the Comprehensive.

Sanskit Text: स रायस खामुप सर्जा गर्णानः पुरुश्चन्द्रस्य तवमिन्द्रवस्वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa rāyas khāmupa sṛjā ghṛṇānaḥ puruścandrasya tvamindravasvaḥ |
Translation: 4 Lauded by us, let flow the spring, O Indra, of excellent and brightly-shining riches.

Sanskit Text: पतिर्बभूथासमो जनानामेको विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: patirbabhūthāsamo janānāmeko viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā ||
Translation: For thou art Lord of men, without an equal: of all the world thou art the only Sovran.

Sanskit Text: स तु शरुधि शरुत्या यो दुवोयुर्द्यौर्न भूमाभि रायोर्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tu śrudhi śrutyā yo duvoyurdyaurna bhūmābhi rāyoaryaḥ |
Translation: 5 Hear what thou mayst hear, thou who, fain for worship, as heaven girds earth, guardest thy servant's treasure;

Sanskit Text: असो यथा नः शवसा चकानो युगे-युगे वयसा चेकितानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aso yathā naḥ śavasā cakāno yughe-yughe vayasā cekitānaḥ ||
Translation: Tlat thou mayst be our own, joying in power, famed through thy might in every generation.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाग रथं विश्ववारं त उग्रेन्द्र युक्तासो हरयो वहन्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāgh rathaṃ viśvavāraṃ ta ughrendra yuktāso harayo vahantu |
Translation: 1. LET thy Bay Horses, yoked, O mighty Indra, bring thy car hither fraught with every blessing.

Sanskit Text: कीरिश्चिद धि तवा हवते सवर्वान रधीमहि सधमादस्तेद्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kīriścid dhi tvā havate svarvān ṛdhīmahi sadhamādasteadya ||
Translation: For thee, the Heavenly, e’en the poor invoketh: may we this day, thy feast-companions, prosper.

Sanskit Text: परो दरोणे हरयः कर्माग्मन पुनानास रज्यन्तो अभूवन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pro droṇe harayaḥ karmāghman punānāsa ṛjyanto abhūvan |
Translation: 2 Forth to the vat the brown drops flow for service, and purified proceed directly forward.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो नो अस्य पूर्व्यः पपीयाद दयुक्षो मदस्य सोम्यस्य राजा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro no asya pūrvyaḥ papīyād dyukṣo madasya somyasya rājā ||
Translation: May Indra drink of this, our guest aforetime, Celestial King of the strong draught of Soma.

Sanskit Text: आसस्राणासः शवसानमछेन्द्रं सुचक्रे रथ्यासो अश्वाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsasrāṇāsaḥ śavasānamachendraṃ sucakre rathyāso aśvāḥ |
Translation: 3 Bringing us hitherward all-potent Indra on well-wheeled chariot, may the Steeds who bear him

Sanskit Text: अभि शरव रज्यन्तो वहेयुर्नू चिन नु वायोरम्र्तं विदस्येत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi śrava ṛjyanto vaheyurnū cin nu vāyoramṛtaṃ vidasyet ||
Translation: Convey him on the road direct to glory, and ne’er may Vāyu's Amṛta cease and fail him.

Sanskit Text: वरिष्ठो अस्य दक्षिणामियर्तीन्द्रो मघोनां तुविकूर्मितमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: variṣṭho asya dakṣiṇāmiyartīndro maghonāṃ tuvikūrmitamaḥ |
Translation: 4 Supreme, he stirs this man to give the guerdon,—Indra, most efficacious of the princes,—

Sanskit Text: यया वज्रिवः परियास्यंहो मघा च धर्ष्णो दयसे वि सूरीन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayā vajrivaḥ pariyāsyaṃho maghā ca dhṛṣṇo dayase vi sūrīn ||
Translation: Wherewith, O Thunderer, thou removest sorrow, and, Bold One! partest wealth among the nobles.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो वाजस्य सथविरस्य दातेन्द्रो गीर्भिर्वर्धतां वर्द्धमहाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro vājasya sthavirasya dātendro ghīrbhirvardhatāṃ vṛddhamahāḥ |
Translation: 5 Indra is hewho gives enduring vigour: may our songs magnify the God Most Mighty.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो वर्त्रं हनिष्ठो अस्तु सत्वा ता सूरिः पर्णति तूतुजानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro vṛtraṃ haniṣṭho astu satvā tā sūriḥ pṛṇati tūtujānaḥ ||
Translation: Best Vṛtra-slayer be the Hero Indra these things he gives as Prince, with strong endeavour.

Sanskit Text: अपादित उदु नश्चित्रतमो महीं भर्षद दयुमतीमिन्द्रहूतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apādita udu naścitratamo mahīṃ bharṣad dyumatīmindrahūtim |
Translation: 1. HE hath drunk hence, Most Marvellous, and carried away our great and splendid call on Indra.

Sanskit Text: पन्यसीं धीतिं दैव्यस्य यामञ जनस्य रातिं वनते सुदानुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: panyasīṃ dhītiṃ daivyasya yāmañ janasya rātiṃ vanate sudānuḥ ||
Translation: The Bounteous, when we serve the Gods, accepteth song yet more famous and the gifts we bring him.

Sanskit Text: दूराच्चिदा वसतो अस्य कर्णा घोषादिन्द्रस्य तन्यति बरुवाणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūrāccidā vasato asya karṇā ghoṣādindrasya tanyati bruvāṇaḥ |
Translation: 2 The speaker filleth with a cry to Indra his ears who cometh nigh e’en from a distance.

Sanskit Text: एयमेनं देवहूतिर्वव्र्त्यान मद्र्यगिन्द्रमियं रच्यमाना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eyamenaṃ devahūtirvavṛtyān madryaghindramiyaṃ ṛcyamānā ||
Translation: May this my call bring Indra to my presence, this call to Gods composed in sacred verses.

Sanskit Text: तं वो धिया परमया पुराजामजरमिन्द्रमभ्यनूष्यर्कैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vo dhiyā paramayā purājāmajaramindramabhyanūṣyarkaiḥ |
Translation: 3 Him have I sung with my best song and praises, Indra of ancient birth and Everlasting.

Sanskit Text: बरह्मा च गिरो दधिरे समस्मिन महांश्च सतोमो अधि वर्धदिन्द्रे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmā ca ghiro dadhire samasmin mahāṃśca stomo adhi vardhadindre ||
Translation: For prayer and songs in him are concentrated: let laud wax mighty when addressed to Indra:

Sanskit Text: वर्धाद यं यज्ञ उत सोम इन्द्रं वर्धाद बरह्म गिर उक्था च मन्म |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vardhād yaṃ yajña uta soma indraṃ vardhād brahma ghira ukthā ca manma |
Translation: 4 Indra, whom sacrifice shall strengthen, Soma, and song and hymn, and praises and devotion,

Sanskit Text: वर्धाहैनमुषसो यामन्नक्तोर्वर्धान मासाः शरदो दयाव इन्द्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vardhāhainamuṣaso yāmannaktorvardhān māsāḥ śarado dyāva indram ||
Translation: Whom Dawns shall strengthen when the night departeth, Indra whom days shall strengthen, months, and autumns.

Sanskit Text: एवा जज्ञानं सहसे असामि वाव्र्धानं राधसे च शरुताय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā jajñānaṃ sahase asāmi vāvṛdhānaṃ rādhase ca śrutāya |
Translation: 5 Him, born for conquering might in full perfection, and waxen strongfor bounty and for glory,

Sanskit Text: महामुग्रमवसे विप्र नूनमा विवासेम वर्त्रतूर्येषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahāmughramavase vipra nūnamā vivāsema vṛtratūryeṣu ||
Translation: Great, Powerful, will we to-day, O singer, invite to aid. us and to quell our foemen.

Sanskit Text: मन्द्रस्य कवेर्दिव्यस्य वह्नेर्विप्रमन्मनो वचनस्य मध्वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mandrasya kaverdivyasya vahnervipramanmano vacanasya madhvaḥ |
Translation: 1. OF this our charming, our celestial Soma, eloquent, wise, Priest, with inspired devotion,

Sanskit Text: अपा नस्तस्य सचनस्य देवेषो युवस्व गर्णते गोग्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apā nastasya sacanasya deveṣo yuvasva ghṛṇate ghoaghrāḥ ||
Translation: Of this thy close attendant, hast thou drunken. God, send the singer food with milk to grace it.

Sanskit Text: अयमुशानः पर्यद्रिमुस्र रतधीतिभिर्र्तयुग युजानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayamuśānaḥ paryadrimusra ṛtadhītibhirṛtayugh yujānaḥ |
Translation: 2 Craving the kine, rushing against the mountain led on by Law, with holyminded comrades,

Sanskit Text: रुजदरुग्णं वि वलस्य सानुं पणीन्र्वचोभिरभि योधदिन्द्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rujadarughṇaṃ vi valasya sānuṃ paṇīnrvacobhirabhi yodhadindraḥ ||
Translation: He broke the never-broken ridge of Vala. With words of might Indra subdued the Paṇis.

Sanskit Text: अयं दयोतयदद्युतो वयक्तून दोषा वस्तोः शरद इन्दुरिन्द्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ dyotayadadyuto vyaktūn doṣā vastoḥ śarada indurindra |
Translation: 3 This Indu lighted darksome nights, O Indra, throughout the years, at morning and at evening.

Sanskit Text: इमं केतुमदधुर्नू चिदह्नां शुचिजन्मन उषसश्चकार ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ ketumadadhurnū cidahnāṃ śucijanmana uṣasaścakāra ||
Translation: Him have they stablished as the days' bright ensign. He made the Mornings to be born in splendour.

Sanskit Text: अयं रोचयदरुचो रुचानो.अयं वासयद वय रतेन पूर्वीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ rocayadaruco rucāno.ayaṃ vāsayad vy ṛtena pūrvīḥ |
Translation: 4 He shone and caused to shme the worlds that shone not. By Law he lighted up the host of Mornings.

Sanskit Text: अयमीयत रतयुग्भिरश्वैः सवर्विदा नाभिना चर्षणिप्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayamīyata ṛtayughbhiraśvaiḥ svarvidā nābhinā carṣaṇiprāḥ ||
Translation: He moves with Steeds yoked by eternal Order, contenting men with nave that finds the sunlight.

Sanskit Text: नू गर्णानो गर्णते परत्न राजन्निषः पिन्व वसुदेयाय पूर्वीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū ghṛṇāno ghṛṇate pratna rājanniṣaḥ pinva vasudeyāya pūrvīḥ |
Translation: 5 Now, praised, O Ancient King! fill thou the singer with plenteous food that he may deal forth treasures.

Sanskit Text: अप ओषधीरविषा वनानि गा अर्वतो नॄन रचसे रिरीहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa oṣadhīraviṣā vanāni ghā arvato nṝn ṛcase rirīhi ||
Translation: Give waters, herbs that have no poison, forests, and kine, and steeds, and men, to him who lauds thee.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र पिब तुभ्यं सुतो मदायाव सय हरी वि मुचा सखाया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra piba tubhyaṃ suto madāyāva sya harī vi mucā sakhāyā |
Translation: 1. DRINK, Indra; juice is shed to make thee joyful: loose thy Bay Steeds and give thy friends their freedom.

Sanskit Text: उत पर गाय गण आ निषद्याथा यज्ञाय गर्णते वयो धाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta pra ghāya ghaṇa ā niṣadyāthā yajñāya ghṛṇate vayo dhāḥ ||
Translation: Begin the song, seated in our assembly. Give strength for sacrifice to him who singeth.

Sanskit Text: अस्य पिब यस्य जज्ञान इन्द्र मदाय करत्वे अपिबो विरप्शिन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya piba yasya jajñāna indra madāya kratve apibo virapśin |
Translation: 2 Drink thou of this whereof at birth, O Indra, thou drankest, Mighty One for power and rapture.

Sanskit Text: तमु ते गावो नर आपो अद्रिरिन्दुं समह्यन पीतये समस्मै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamu te ghāvo nara āpo adririnduṃ samahyan pītaye samasmai ||
Translation: The men, the pressing-stones, the cows, the waters have made this Soma ready for thy drinking.

Sanskit Text: समिद्धे अग्नौ सुत इन्द्र सोम आ तवा वहन्तु हरयो वहिष्ठाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samiddhe aghnau suta indra soma ā tvā vahantu harayo vahiṣṭhāḥ |
Translation: 3 The fire is kindled, Soma pressed, O Indra: let thy Bays, best to draw, convey thee hither.

Sanskit Text: तवायता मनसा जोहवीमीन्द्रा याहि सुविताय महे नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāyatā manasā johavīmīndrā yāhi suvitāya mahe naḥ ||
Translation: With mind devoted, Indra, I invoke thee. Come, for our great prosperity approach us.

Sanskit Text: आ याहि शश्वदुशता ययाथेन्द्र महा मनसा सोमपेयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yāhi śaśvaduśatā yayāthendra mahā manasā somapeyam |
Translation: 4 Indra, come hither: evermore thou camest through our great strong desire to drink the Soma.

Sanskit Text: उप बरह्माणि शर्णव इमा नो.अथा ते यज्ञस्तन्वे वयो धात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa brahmāṇi śṛṇava imā no.athā te yajñastanve vayo dhāt ||
Translation: Listen and hear the prayers which now we offer, and let this sacrifice increase thy vigour.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्र दिवि पार्ये यद रधग यद वा सवे सदने यत्र वासि |
