Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindra divi pārye yad ṛdhagh yad vā sve sadane yatra vāsi |
Translation: 5 Mayst thou, O Indra, on the day of trial, present or absent, wheresoe’er thou dwellest,

Sanskit Text: अतो नो यज्ञमवसे नियुत्वान सजोषाः पाहि गिर्वणो मरुद्भिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ato no yajñamavase niyutvān sajoṣāḥ pāhi ghirvaṇo marudbhiḥ ||
Translation: Thence, with thy team, accordant with the Maruts, Song-lover! guard our sacrifice, to help us.

Sanskit Text: अहेळमान उप याहि यज्ञं तुभ्यं पवन्त इन्दवः सुतासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aheḷamāna upa yāhi yajñaṃ tubhyaṃ pavanta indavaḥ sutāsaḥ |
Translation: 1. COME gracious to our sacrifice, O Indra: pressed Soma-drops are purified to please thee.

Sanskit Text: गावो न वज्रिन सवमोको अछेन्द्रा गहि परथमो यज्ञियानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāvo na vajrin svamoko achendrā ghahi prathamo yajñiyānām ||
Translation: As cattle seek their home, so Thunderwielder, come, Indra, first of those who claim our worship.

Sanskit Text: या ते काकुत सुक्र्ता या वरिष्ठा यया शश्वत पिबसि मध्व ऊर्मिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā te kākut sukṛtā yā variṣṭhā yayā śaśvat pibasi madhva ūrmim |
Translation: 2 With that well-formed most wide-extending palate, wherewith thou ever drinkest streams of sweetness,

Sanskit Text: तया पाहि पर ते अध्वर्युरस्थात सं ते वज्रोवर्ततामिन्द्र गव्युः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tayā pāhi pra te adhvaryurasthāt saṃ te vajrovartatāmindra ghavyuḥ ||
Translation: Drink thou; the Adhvaryu standeth up before thee: let thy spoil-winning thunderbolt attend thee.

Sanskit Text: एष दरप्सो वर्षभो विश्वरूप इन्द्राय वर्ष्णे समकारि सोमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa drapso vṛṣabho viśvarūpa indrāya vṛṣṇe samakāri somaḥ |
Translation: 3 This drop, steer-strong and omniform, the Soma, hath been made ready for the Bull, for India.

Sanskit Text: एतं पिब हरिव सथातरुग्र यस्येशिषे परदिवि यस्तेन्नम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: etaṃ piba hariva sthātarughra yasyeśiṣe pradivi yasteannam ||
Translation: Drink this, Lord of the Bays, thou Strong Supporter, this that is thine of old, thy food for ever.

Sanskit Text: सुतः सोमो असुतादिन्द्र वस्यानयं शरेयाञ्चिकितुषे रणाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sutaḥ somo asutādindra vasyānayaṃ śreyāñcikituṣe raṇāya |
Translation: 4 Soma when pressed excels the unpressed Soma, better, for one who knows, to give him pleasure.

Sanskit Text: एतं तितिर्व उप याहि यज्ञं तेन विश्वास्तविषीरा पर्णस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: etaṃ titirva upa yāhi yajñaṃ tena viśvāstaviṣīrā pṛṇasva ||
Translation: Come to this sacrifice of ours, O Victor replenish all thy powers with this libation.

Sanskit Text: हवयामसि तवेन्द्र याह्यर्वां अरं ते सोमस्तन्वे भवाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hvayāmasi tvendra yāhyarvāṃ araṃ te somastanve bhavāti |
Translation: 5 We call on thee, O Indra: come thou hither: sufficient be the Soma for thy body.

Sanskit Text: शतक्रतो मादयस्वा सुतेषु परास्मानव पर्तनासु पर विक्षु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śatakrato mādayasvā suteṣu prāsmānava pṛtanāsu pra vikṣu ||
Translation: Rejoice thee, Śatakratu! in the juices guard us in wars, guard us among our people.

Sanskit Text: परत्यस्मै पिपीषते विश्वानि विदुषे भर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratyasmai pipīṣate viśvāni viduṣe bhara |
Translation: 1. BRING sacrificial gifts to him, Omniscient, for he longs to drink,

Sanskit Text: अरंगमाय जग्मये.अपश्चाद्दघ्वने नरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: araṃghamāya jaghmaye.apaścāddaghvane nare ||
Translation: The Wanderer who comes with speed, the Hero ever in the van.

Sanskit Text: एमेनं परत्येतन सोमेभिः सोमपातमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: emenaṃ pratyetana somebhiḥ somapātamam |
Translation: 2 With Soma go ye nigh to him chief drinker of the Soma's juice:

Sanskit Text: अमत्रेभिर्र्जीषिणमिन्द्रं सुतेभिरिन्दुभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: amatrebhirṛjīṣiṇamindraṃ sutebhirindubhiḥ ||
Translation: With beakers to the Impetuous God, to Indra with the drops effused.

Sanskit Text: यदी सुतेभिरिन्दुभिः सोमेभिः परतिभूषथ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadī sutebhirindubhiḥ somebhiḥ pratibhūṣatha |
Translation: 3 What time, with Soma, with the juice effused, ye come before the God,

Sanskit Text: वेदा विश्वस्य मेधिरो धर्षत तं-तमिदेषते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vedā viśvasya medhiro dhṛṣat taṃ-tamideṣate ||
Translation: Full wise he knows the hope of each, and, Bold One, strikes this foe and that.

Sanskit Text: अस्मा-अस्मा इदन्धसो.अध्वर्यो पर भरा सुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmā-asmā idandhaso.adhvaryo pra bharā sutam |
Translation: 4 To him, Adhvaryu! yea, to him give offerings of the juice expressed.

Sanskit Text: कुवित समस्य जेन्यस्य शर्धतो.अभिशस्तेरवस्परत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvit samasya jenyasya śardhato.abhiśasteravasparat ||
Translation: Will he not keep us safely from the spiteful curse of each presumptuous high-born foe?

Sanskit Text: यस्य तयच्छम्बरं मदे दिवोदासाय रन्धयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya tyacchambaraṃ made divodāsāya randhayaḥ |
Translation: 1. IN whose wild joy thou madest once Śambara Divodāsa's prey,

Sanskit Text: अयं स सोम इन्द्र ते सुतः पिब ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ sa soma indra te sutaḥ piba ||
Translation: This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra: drink!

Sanskit Text: यस्य तीव्रसुतं मदं मध्यमन्तं च रक्षसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya tīvrasutaṃ madaṃ madhyamantaṃ ca rakṣase |
Translation: 2 Whose gladdening draught, shed from the points, thou guardest in the midst and end,

Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ sa... ||
Translation: This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra drink!

Sanskit Text: यस्य गा अन्तरश्मनो मदे दर्ळ्हा अवास्र्जः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya ghā antaraśmano made dṛḷhā avāsṛjaḥ |
Translation: 3 In whose wild joy thou settest free the kine held fast within the rock,

Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ sa .. . ||
Translation: This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra: drink!

Sanskit Text: यस्य मन्दानो अन्धसो माघोनं दधिषे शवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya mandāno andhaso māghonaṃ dadhiṣe śavaḥ |
Translation: 4 This, in whose juice delighting thou gainest the might of Maghavan,

Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ sa... ||
Translation: This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra drink!

Sanskit Text: यो रयिवो रयिन्तमो यो दयुम्नैर्द्युम्नवत्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo rayivo rayintamo yo dyumnairdyumnavattamaḥ |
Translation: 1. THAT which is wealthiest, Wealthy God in splendoursmost illustrious,

Sanskit Text: सोमः सुतः स इन्द्र ते.अस्ति सवधापते मदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaḥ sutaḥ sa indra te.asti svadhāpate madaḥ ||
Translation: Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

Sanskit Text: यः शग्मस्तुविशग्म ते रायो दामा मतीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ śaghmastuviśaghma te rāyo dāmā matīnām |
Translation: 2 Effectual, Most Effectual One! thine, as bestowing wealth of hymns,

Sanskrit Transliteration: somaḥ sutaḥ ... ||
Translation: Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

Sanskit Text: येन वर्द्धो न शवसा तुरो न सवाभिरूतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena vṛddho na śavasā turo na svābhirūtibhiḥ |
Translation: 3 Wherewith thou art increased in strength, and conquerest with thy proper aids,

Sanskrit Transliteration: somaḥ sutaḥ ... ||
Translation: Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

Sanskit Text: तयमु वो अप्रहणं गर्णीषे शवसस पतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tyamu vo aprahaṇaṃ ghṛṇīṣe śavasas patim |
Translation: 4 Him for your sake I glorify as Lord of Strength who wrongeth none,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं विश्वासाहं नरं मंहिष्ठं विश्वचर्षणिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ viśvāsāhaṃ naraṃ maṃhiṣṭhaṃ viśvacarṣaṇim ||
Translation: The Hero Indra, conquering all, Most Bounteous, God of all the tribes.

Sanskit Text: यं वर्धयन्तीद गिरः पतिं तुरस्य राधसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ vardhayantīd ghiraḥ patiṃ turasya rādhasaḥ |
Translation: 5 Those Goddesses, both Heaven and Earth, revere the power and might of him,

Sanskit Text: तमिन्न्वस्य रोदसी देवी शुष्मं सपर्यतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taminnvasya rodasī devī śuṣmaṃ saparyataḥ ||
Translation: Him whom our songs increase in strength, the Lord of bounty swift to come.

Sanskit Text: तद व उक्थस्य बर्हणेन्द्रायोपस्त्र्णीषणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad va ukthasya barhaṇendrāyopastṛṇīṣaṇi |
Translation: 6 To seat your Indra, I will spread abroad with power this song of praise.

Sanskit Text: विपो न यस्योतयो वि यद रोहन्ति सक्षितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vipo na yasyotayo vi yad rohanti sakṣitaḥ ||
Translation: The saving succours that abide in him, like songs, extend and grow.

Sanskit Text: अविदद दक्षं मित्रो नवीयान पपानो देवेभ्यो वस्यो अचैत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avidad dakṣaṃ mitro navīyān papāno devebhyo vasyo acait |
Translation: 7 A recent Friend, he found the skilful priest: he drank, and showed forth treasure from the Gods.

Sanskit Text: ससवान सतौलाभिर्धौतरीभिरुरुष्या पायुरभवत सखिभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sasavān staulābhirdhautarībhiruruṣyā pāyurabhavat sakhibhyaḥ ||
Translation: He conquered, borne by strong all-shaking mares, and was with far-spread power his friends' Protector.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य पथि वेधा अपायि शरिये मनांसि देवासो अक्रन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya pathi vedhā apāyi śriye manāṃsi devāso akran |
Translation: 8 In course of Law the sapient juice was quaffed: the Deities to glory turned their mind.

Sanskit Text: दधानो नाम महो वचोभिर्वपुर्द्र्शये वेन्यो वयावः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhāno nāma maho vacobhirvapurdṛśaye venyo vyāvaḥ ||
Translation: Winning through hymns a lofty title, he, the Lovely, made his beauteous form apparent.

Sanskit Text: दयुमत्तमं दक्षं धेह्यस्मे सेधा जनानां पूर्वीररातीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyumattamaṃ dakṣaṃ dhehyasme sedhā janānāṃ pūrvīrarātīḥ |
Translation: 9 Bestow on us the most illustrious strength ward off men's manifold malignities.

Sanskit Text: वर्षीयो वयः कर्णुहि शचीभिर्धनस्य सातावस्मानविड्ढि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: varṣīyo vayaḥ kṛṇuhi śacībhirdhanasya sātāvasmānaviḍḍhi ||
Translation: Give with thy might abundant vital force, and aid us graciously in gaining riches.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र तुभ्यमिन मघवन्नभूम वयं दात्रे हरिवो मा विवेनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra tubhyamin maghavannabhūma vayaṃ dātre harivo mā vivenaḥ |
Translation: 10 We turn to thee as Giver, liberal Indra. Lord of the Bay Steeds, be not thou ungracious.

Sanskit Text: नकिरापिर्दद्र्शे मर्त्यत्रा किमङग रध्रचोदनन्त्वाहुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nakirāpirdadṛśe martyatrā kimaṅgha radhracodanantvāhuḥ ||
Translation: No friend among mankind have we to lookto: why have men called thee him who spurs the niggard?

Sanskit Text: मा जस्वने वर्षभ नो ररीथा मा ते रेवतः सख्ये रिषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā jasvane vṛṣabha no rarīthā mā te revataḥ sakhye riṣāma |
Translation: 11 Give us not up, Strong Hero! to the hungry: unharmed be we whom thou, so rich, befriendest.

Sanskit Text: पूर्वीष ट इन्द्र निष्षिधो जनेषु जह्यसुष्वीन पर वर्हाप्र्णतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvīṣ ṭa indra niṣṣidho janeṣu jahyasuṣvīn pra vṛhāpṛṇataḥ ||
Translation: Full many a boon hast thou for men demolish those who present no gifts nor pour oblations.

Sanskit Text: उदभ्राणीव सतनयन्नियर्तीन्द्रो राधांस्यश्व्यानि गव्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udabhrāṇīva stanayanniyartīndro rādhāṃsyaśvyāni ghavyā |
Translation: 12 As Indra thundering impels the rain-clouds, so doth he send us store of kine and horses.

Sanskit Text: तवमसि परदिवः कारुधाया मा तवादामान आ दभन्मघोनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamasi pradivaḥ kārudhāyā mā tvādāmāna ā dabhanmaghonaḥ ||
Translation: Thou art of old the Cherisher of singers let not the rich who bring no gifts deceive thee.

Sanskit Text: अध्वर्यो वीर पर महे सुतानामिन्द्राय भर स हयस्य राजा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhvaryo vīra pra mahe sutānāmindrāya bhara sa hyasya rājā |
Translation: 13 Adbyaryu, hero, bring to mighty Indrafor he is King thereof-the pressed-out juices;

Sanskit Text: यः पूर्व्याभिरुत नूतनाभिर्गीर्भिर्वाव्र्धे गर्णतां रषीणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ pūrvyābhiruta nūtanābhirghīrbhirvāvṛdhe ghṛṇatāṃ ṛṣīṇām ||
Translation: To him exalted by the hymns and praises, ancient and modern, of the singing Ṛṣis.

Sanskit Text: अस्य मदे पुरु वर्पांसि विद्वानिन्द्रो वर्त्राण्यप्रती जघान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya made puru varpāṃsi vidvānindro vṛtrāṇyapratī jaghāna |
Translation: 14 In the wild joy of this hath Indra, knowing full many a form, struck down resistless Vṛtras.

Sanskit Text: तमु पर होषि मधुमन्तमस्मै सोमं वीराय शिप्रिणे पिबध्यै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamu pra hoṣi madhumantamasmai somaṃ vīrāya śipriṇe pibadhyai ||
Translation: Proclaim aloud to him the savoury Soma so that the Hero, strong of jaw, may drink it.

Sanskit Text: पाता सुतमिन्द्रो अस्तु सोमं हन्ता वर्त्रं वज्रेण मन्दसानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pātā sutamindro astu somaṃ hantā vṛtraṃ vajreṇa mandasānaḥ |
Translation: 15 May Indra drink this Soma poured to please him, and cheered therewith slay Vṛtra with his thunder.

Sanskit Text: गन्ता यज्ञं परावतश्चिदछा वसुर्धीनामविता कारुधायाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghantā yajñaṃ parāvataścidachā vasurdhīnāmavitā kārudhāyāḥ ||
Translation: Come to our sacrifice even from a distance, good lover of our songs, the bard's Supporter.

Sanskit Text: इदं तयत पात्रमिन्द्रपानमिन्द्रस्य परियमम्र्तमपायि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ tyat pātramindrapānamindrasya priyamamṛtamapāyi |
Translation: 16 The cup whence Indra drinks the draught is present: the Amṛta dear to Indra hath been drunken,

Sanskit Text: मत्सद यथा सौमनसाय देवं वयस्मद दवेषो युयवद वयंहः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: matsad yathā saumanasāya devaṃ vyasmad dveṣo yuyavad vyaṃhaḥ ||
Translation: That it may cheer the God to gracious favour, and keep far from us hatred and affliction.

Sanskit Text: एना मन्दानो जहि शूर शत्रूञ जामिमजामिं मघवन्नमित्रान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: enā mandāno jahi śūra śatrūñ jāmimajāmiṃ maghavannamitrān |
Translation: 17 Therewith enraptured, Hero, slay our foemen, the unfriendly, Maghavan be they kin or strangers,

Sanskit Text: अभिषेणानभ्यादेदिशानान पराच इन्द्र पर मर्णाजही च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhiṣeṇānabhyādediśānān parāca indra pra mṛṇājahī ca ||
Translation: Those who still aim their hostile darts to smite us, turn them to flight, O Indra, crush and kill them.

Sanskit Text: आसु षमा णो मघवन्निन्द्र पर्त्स्वस्मभ्यं महि वरिवः सुगं कः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsu ṣmā ṇo maghavannindra pṛtsvasmabhyaṃ mahi varivaḥ sughaṃ kaḥ |
Translation: 18 O Indra Maghavan, in these our battles win easy paths for us and ample freedom.

Sanskit Text: अपां तोकस्य तनयस्य जेष इन्द्र सूरीन कर्णुहिस्मा नो अर्धम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāṃ tokasya tanayasya jeṣa indra sūrīn kṛṇuhismā no ardham ||
Translation: That we may gain waters and seed and offspring, set thou our princes on thy side, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: आ तवा हरयो वर्षणो युजाना वर्षरथासो वर्षरश्मयो.अत्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tvā harayo vṛṣaṇo yujānā vṛṣarathāso vṛṣaraśmayo.atyāḥ |
Translation: 19 Let thy Bay Stallions, harnessed, bring thee hither, Steeds with strong chariot and strong reins to hold them,

Sanskit Text: अस्मत्राञ्चो वर्षणो वज्रवाहो वर्ष्णे मदाय सुयुजोवहन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmatrāñco vṛṣaṇo vajravāho vṛṣṇe madāya suyujovahantu ||
Translation: Strong Horses, speeding hither, bearing thunder, well-harnessed, for the strong exciting potion.

Sanskit Text: आ ते वर्षन वर्षणो दरोणमस्थुर्घ्र्तप्रुषो नोर्मयो मदन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā te vṛṣan vṛṣaṇo droṇamasthurghṛtapruṣo normayo madantaḥ |
Translation: 20 Beside the vat, Strong God! stand thy strong Horses, shining with holy oil, like waves exulting.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र पर तुभ्यं वर्षभिः सुतानां वर्ष्णे भरन्तिव्र्षभाय सोमम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra pra tubhyaṃ vṛṣabhiḥ sutānāṃ vṛṣṇe bharantivṛṣabhāya somam ||
Translation: Indra, they bring to thee, the Strong and Mighty, Soma of juices shed by mighty press-stones.

Sanskit Text: वर्षासि दिवो वर्षभः पर्थिव्या वर्षा सिन्धूनां वर्षभस्तियानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣāsi divo vṛṣabhaḥ pṛthivyā vṛṣā sindhūnāṃ vṛṣabhastiyānām |
Translation: 21 Thou art the Bull of earth, the Bull of heaven, Bull of the rivers, Bull of standing waters.

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्णे त इन्दुर्व्र्षभ पीपाय सवादू रसो मधुपेयो वराय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṇe ta indurvṛṣabha pīpāya svādū raso madhupeyo varāya ||
Translation: For thee, the Strong, O Bull, hath Indu swollen. juice pleasant, sweet to drink, for thine election.

Sanskit Text: अयं देवः सहसा जायमान इन्द्रेण युजा पणिमस्तभायत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ devaḥ sahasā jāyamāna indreṇa yujā paṇimastabhāyat |
Translation: 22 This God, with might, when first he had his being, with Indra for ally, held fast the Paṇi.

Sanskit Text: अयं सवस्य पितुरायुधानीन्दुरमुष्णादशिवस्य मायाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ svasya piturāyudhānīnduramuṣṇādaśivasya māyāḥ ||
Translation: This Indu stole away the warlike weapons, and foiled the arts of his malignant father.

Sanskit Text: अयमक्र्णोदुषसः सुपत्नीरयं सूर्ये अदधाज्ज्योतिरन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayamakṛṇoduṣasaḥ supatnīrayaṃ sūrye adadhājjyotirantaḥ |
Translation: 23 The Dawns he wedded to a glorious Consort, and set within the Sun the light that lights him.

Sanskit Text: अयं तरिधातु दिवि रोचनेषु तरितेषु विन्ददम्र्तं निगूळ्हम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ tridhātu divi rocaneṣu triteṣu vindadamṛtaṃ nighūḷham ||
Translation: He found in heaven, in the third lucid regions, the threefold Amṛta in its close concealment.

Sanskit Text: अयं दयावाप्र्थिवी वि षकभायदयं रथमयुनक सप्तरश्मिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī vi ṣkabhāyadayaṃ rathamayunak saptaraśmim |
Translation: 24 He stayed and held the heaven and earth asunder: the chariot with the sevenfold reins he harnessed.

Sanskit Text: अयं गोषु शच्या पक्वमन्तः सोमो दाधार दशयन्त्रमुत्सम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ ghoṣu śacyā pakvamantaḥ somo dādhāra daśayantramutsam ||
Translation: This Soma Set with power within the milch-kine a spring whose ripe contents ten fingers empty.

Sanskit Text: य आनयत परावतः सुनीती तुर्वशं यदुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya ānayat parāvataḥ sunītī turvaśaṃ yadum |
Translation: 1. THAT Indra is our youthful Friend, who with his trusty guidance led

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रः सनो युवा सखा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraḥ sano yuvā sakhā ||
Translation: Turvaśa, Yadu from afar.

Sanskit Text: अविप्रे चिद वयो दधदनाशुना चिदर्वता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avipre cid vayo dadhadanāśunā cidarvatā |
Translation: 2 Even to the dull and uninspired Indra, gives vital power, and wins

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो जेता हितं धनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro jetā hitaṃ dhanam ||
Translation: Even with slow steed the offered prize.

Sanskit Text: महीरस्य परणीतयः पूर्वीरुत परशस्तयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahīrasya praṇītayaḥ pūrvīruta praśastayaḥ |
Translation: 3 Great are his ways of guiding us, andṅanilbld are Ins eulogies:

Sanskit Text: नास्य कषीयन्त ऊतयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāsya kṣīyanta ūtayaḥ ||
Translation: His kind protections never fail.

Sanskit Text: सखायो बरह्मवाहसे.अर्चत पर च गायत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhāyo brahmavāhase.arcata pra ca ghāyata |
Translation: 4 Friends, sing your psalm and offer praise to him to whom the prayer is brought:

Sanskit Text: स हि नः परमतिर्मही ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi naḥ pramatirmahī ||
Translation: For our great Providence is he.

Sanskit Text: तवमेकस्य वर्त्रहन्नविता दवयोरसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamekasya vṛtrahannavitā dvayorasi |
Translation: 5 Thou, Slaughterer of Vṛtra, art Guardian and Friend of one and two,

Sanskit Text: उतेद्र्शे यथा वयम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utedṛśe yathā vayam ||
Translation: Yea, of a man like one of us.

Sanskit Text: नयसीद वति दविषः कर्णोष्युक्थशंसिनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nayasīd vati dviṣaḥ kṛṇoṣyukthaśaṃsinaḥ |
Translation: 6 Beyond men's hate thou leadest us, and givest cause to sing thy praise:

Sanskit Text: नर्भिः सुवीर उच्यसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛbhiḥ suvīra ucyase ||
Translation: Good hero art thou called by men.

Sanskit Text: बरह्माणं बरह्मवाहसं गीर्भिः सखायं रग्मियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmāṇaṃ brahmavāhasaṃ ghīrbhiḥ sakhāyaṃ ṛghmiyam |
Translation: 7 I call with hymns, as ’twere a cow to milk, the Friend who merits praise,

Sanskit Text: गांन दोहसे हुवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāṃna dohase huve ||
Translation: The Brahman who accepts the prayer.

Sanskit Text: यस्य विश्वानि हस्तयोरूचुर्वसूनि नि दविता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya viśvāni hastayorūcurvasūni ni dvitā |
Translation: 8 Him in whose hands they say are stored all treasures from the days of old,

Sanskit Text: वीरस्य पर्तनाषहः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vīrasya pṛtanāṣahaḥ ||
Translation: The Hero, conquering in the fight.

Sanskit Text: वि दर्ळ्हानि चिदद्रिवो जनानां शचीपते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi dṛḷhāni cidadrivo janānāṃ śacīpate |
Translation: 9 Lord of Strength, Caster of the Stone, destroy the firm forts built by men,

Sanskit Text: वर्ह माया अनानत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛha māyā anānata ||
Translation: And foil their arts, unbending God!

Sanskit Text: तमु तवा सत्य सोमपा इन्द्र वाजानां पते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamu tvā satya somapā indra vājānāṃ pate |
Translation: 10 Thee, thee as such, O Lord of Power, O Indra, Soma-drinker, true,

Sanskit Text: अहूमहि शरवस्यवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahūmahi śravasyavaḥ ||
Translation: We, fain for glory, have invoked.

Sanskit Text: तमु तवा यः पुरासिथ यो वा नूनं हिते धने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamu tvā yaḥ purāsitha yo vā nūnaṃ hite dhane |
Translation: 11 Such as thou wast of old, and art now to be called on when the prize

Sanskit Text: हव्यःस शरुधी हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: havyaḥsa śrudhī havam ||
Translation: lies ready, listen to our call.

Sanskit Text: धीभिरर्वद्भिरर्वतो वाजानिन्द्र शरवाय्यान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhībhirarvadbhirarvato vājānindra śravāyyān |
Translation: 12 With hymns and coursers we will gain, Indra, through thee, both steeds and spoil

Sanskit Text: तवया जेष्म हितं धनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā jeṣma hitaṃ dhanam ||
Translation: Most glorious, and the proffered prize.

Sanskit Text: अभूरु वीर गिर्वणो महानिन्द्र धने हिते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhūru vīra ghirvaṇo mahānindra dhane hite |
Translation: 13 Thou, Indra, Lover of the Song, whom men must stir to help, hast been

Sanskit Text: भरे वितन्तसाय्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhare vitantasāyyaḥ ||
Translation: Great in the contest for the prize.

Sanskit Text: या त ऊतिरमित्रहन मक्षूजवस्तमासति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā ta ūtiramitrahan makṣūjavastamāsati |
Translation: 14 Slayer of foes, whatever aid of thine imparts the swiftest course,

Sanskit Text: तया नो हिनुही रथम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tayā no hinuhī ratham ||
Translation: With that impel our car to speed.

Sanskit Text: स रथेन रथीतमो.अस्माकेनाभियुग्वना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa rathena rathītamo.asmākenābhiyughvanā |
Translation: 15 As skilfullest of those who drive the chariot, with our art and aim,

Sanskit Text: जेषि जिष्णो हितं धनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jeṣi jiṣṇo hitaṃ dhanam ||
Translation: O Conqueror, win the proffered prize.

Sanskit Text: य एक इत तमु षटुहि कर्ष्टीनां विचर्षणिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya eka it tamu ṣṭuhi kṛṣṭīnāṃ vicarṣaṇiḥ |
Translation: 16 Praise him who, Matchless and Alone, was born the Lord of living men,

Sanskit Text: पतिर्जज्ञे वर्षक्रतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: patirjajñe vṛṣakratuḥ ||
Translation: Most active, with heroic soul.

Sanskit Text: यो गर्णतामिदासिथापिरूती शिवः सखा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo ghṛṇatāmidāsithāpirūtī śivaḥ sakhā |
Translation: 17 Thou who hast been the singers' Friend, a Friend auspicious with thine aid,

Sanskit Text: स तवंन इन्द्र मर्ळय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvaṃna indra mṛḷaya ||
Translation: As such, O Indra, favour us.

Sanskit Text: धिष्व वज्रं गभस्त्यो रक्षोहत्याय वज्रिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiṣva vajraṃ ghabhastyo rakṣohatyāya vajrivaḥ |
Translation: 18 Grasp in thine arms the thunderbolt, O Thunder-armed, to slay the fiends:

Sanskit Text: सासहीष्ठा अभि सप्र्धः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sāsahīṣṭhā abhi spṛdhaḥ ||
Translation: Mayst thou subdue the foemen's host.

Sanskit Text: परत्नं रयीणां युजं सखायं कीरिचोदनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratnaṃ rayīṇāṃ yujaṃ sakhāyaṃ kīricodanam |
Translation: 19 I call the ancient Friend, allied with wealth, who speeds the lowly man,

Sanskit Text: बरह्मवाहस्तमं हुवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmavāhastamaṃ huve ||
Translation: Him to whom chiefly prayer is brought.

Sanskit Text: स हि विश्वानि पार्थिवानेको वसूनि पत्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi viśvāni pārthivāneko vasūni patyate |
Translation: 20 For he alone is Lord of all the treasures of the earth: he speeds

Sanskit Text: गिर्वणस्तमो अध्रिगुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghirvaṇastamo adhrighuḥ ||
Translation: Hither, chief Lover of the Song.

Sanskit Text: स नो नियुद्भिरा पर्ण कामं वाजेभिरश्विभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no niyudbhirā pṛṇa kāmaṃ vājebhiraśvibhiḥ |
Translation: 21 So with thy yoked teams satisfy our wish with power and wealth in steeds

Sanskit Text: गोमद्भिर्गोपते धर्षत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghomadbhirghopate dhṛṣat ||
Translation: And cattle, boldly, Lord of kine!

Sanskit Text: तद वो गाय सुते सचा पुरुहूताय सत्वने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad vo ghāya sute sacā puruhūtāya satvane |
Translation: 22 Sing this, what time the ' juice is pressed, to him your Hero, Much-invoked,

Sanskit Text: शं यद गवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ yad ghave ||
Translation: To please him as a mighty Steer.

Sanskit Text: न शाकिने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na śākine ||
Translation: 23 He, Excellent, withholdeth not his gift of power and wealth in kine,

Sanskit Text: न घा वसुर्नि यमते दानं वाजस्य गोमतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na ghā vasurni yamate dānaṃ vājasya ghomataḥ |
Translation: When he hath listened to our songs.

Sanskit Text: यत सीमुप शरवद गिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat sīmupa śravad ghiraḥ ||
Translation: 24 May he with might unclose for us the cow's stall, whosesoe’er it be,

Sanskit Text: कुवित्सस्य पर हि वरजं गोमन्तं दस्युहा गमत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvitsasya pra hi vrajaṃ ghomantaṃ dasyuhā ghamat |
Translation: To which the Dasyu-slayer goes.

Sanskit Text: शचीभिरप नो वरत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śacībhirapa no varat ||
Translation: 25 O Indra Śatakratu, these our songs have called aloud to thee,

Sanskit Text: इमा उ तवा शतक्रतो.अभि पर णोनुवुर्गिरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā u tvā śatakrato.abhi pra ṇonuvurghiraḥ |
Translation: Like mother cows to meet their calves.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र वत्संन मातरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra vatsaṃna mātaraḥ ||
Translation: 26 Hard is thy love to win: thou art a Steer to him who longs for steers:

Sanskit Text: दूणाशं सख्यं तव गौरसि वीर गव्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūṇāśaṃ sakhyaṃ tava ghaurasi vīra ghavyate |
Translation: Be to one craving steeds a Steed.

Sanskit Text: अश्वो अश्वायते भव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvo aśvāyate bhava ||
Translation: 27 Delight thee with the juice we pour for thine own great munificence:

Sanskit Text: स मन्दस्वा हयन्धसो ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa mandasvā hyandhaso ... ||
Translation: Yield not thy singer to reproach.

Sanskit Text: इमा उ तवा सुते-सुते नक्षन्ते गिर्वणो गिरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā u tvā sute-sute nakṣante ghirvaṇo ghiraḥ |
Translation: 28 These songs with every draught we pour come, Lover of the Song, to thee,

Sanskit Text: वत्सं गावोन धेनवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vatsaṃ ghāvona dhenavaḥ ||
Translation: As milch-kine hasten to their young

Sanskit Text: पुरूतमं पुरूणां सतोतॄणां विवाचि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purūtamaṃ purūṇāṃ stotṝṇāṃ vivāci |
Translation: 29 To thee most oft invoked, amid the many singers' rivalry

Sanskit Text: वाजेभिर्वाजयताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājebhirvājayatām ||
Translation: Who beg with all their might for wealth.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकमिन्द्र भूतु ते सतोमो वाहिष्ठो अन्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākamindra bhūtu te stomo vāhiṣṭho antamaḥ |
Translation: 30 Nearest and most attractive may our laud, O Indra come to thee.

Sanskit Text: अस्मान राये महे हिनु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmān rāye mahe hinu ||
Translation: Urge thou us on to ample wealth.

Sanskit Text: अधि बर्बुः पणीनां वर्षिष्ठे मूर्धन्नस्थात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi bṛbuḥ paṇīnāṃ varṣiṣṭhe mūrdhannasthāt |
Translation: 31 Brbu hath set himself above the Paṇis, o’er their highest head,

Sanskit Text: उरुः कक्षो न गाङगयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uruḥ kakṣo na ghāṅghyaḥ ||
Translation: Like the wide bush on Gan!gā's bank.

Sanskit Text: यस्य वायोरिव दरवद भद्रा रातिः सहस्रिणी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya vāyoriva dravad bhadrā rātiḥ sahasriṇī |
Translation: 32 He whose good bounty, thousandfold, swift as the rushing of the wind,

Sanskit Text: सद्यो दानाय मंहते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadyo dānāya maṃhate ||
Translation: Suddenly offers as a gift.

Sanskit Text: तत सु नो विश्वे अर्य आ सदा गर्णन्ति कारवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat su no viśve arya ā sadā ghṛṇanti kāravaḥ |
Translation: 33 So all our singers ever praise the pious Brbu's noble deed,

Sanskit Text: बर्बुं सहस्रदातमं सूरिं सहस्रसातमम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛbuṃ sahasradātamaṃ sūriṃ sahasrasātamam ||
Translation: Chief, best to give his thousands, best to give a thousand liberal gifts.

Sanskit Text: तवामिद धि हवामहे साता वाजस्य कारवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmid dhi havāmahe sātā vājasya kāravaḥ |
Translation: 1. THAT we may win us wealth and power we poets, verily, call on thee:

Sanskit Text: तवां वर्त्रेष्विन्द्र सत्पतिं नरस्त्वां काष्ठास्वर्वतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ vṛtreṣvindra satpatiṃ narastvāṃ kāṣṭhāsvarvataḥ ||
Translation: In war men call on thee, Indra, the hero's Lord, in the steed's race-course call on thee.

Sanskit Text: स तवं नश्चित्र वज्रहस्त धर्ष्णुया मह सतवानो अद्रिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvaṃ naścitra vajrahasta dhṛṣṇuyā maha stavāno adrivaḥ |
Translation: 2 As such, O Wonderful, whose hand holds thunder, praised as mighty, Caster of the Stone!

Sanskit Text: गामश्वं रथ्यमिन्द्र सं किर सत्रा वाजं न जिग्युषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāmaśvaṃ rathyamindra saṃ kira satrā vājaṃ na jighyuṣe ||
Translation: Pour on us boldly, Indra, kine and chariotsteeds, ever to be the conqueror's strength.

Sanskit Text: यः सत्राहा विचर्षणिरिन्द्रं तं हूमहे वयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ satrāhā vicarṣaṇirindraṃ taṃ hūmahe vayam |
Translation: 3 We call upon that Indra, who, most active, ever slays the foe:

Sanskit Text: सहस्रमुष्क तुविन्र्म्ण सत्पते भवा समत्सु नो वर्धे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasramuṣka tuvinṛmṇa satpate bhavā samatsu no vṛdhe ||
Translation: Lord of the brave, Most Manly, with a thousand powers, help thou and prosper us in fight.

Sanskit Text: बाधसे जनान वर्षभेव मन्युना घर्षौ मीळ्ह रचीषम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bādhase janān vṛṣabheva manyunā ghṛṣau mīḷha ṛcīṣama |
Translation: 4 Rcisama, thou forcest men as with a bull, with anger, in the furious fray.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकं बोध्यविता महाधने तनूष्वप्सु सूर्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākaṃ bodhyavitā mahādhane tanūṣvapsu sūrye ||
Translation: Be thou our Helper in the mighty battle fought for sunlight, water, and for life.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र जयेष्ठं न आ भरनोजिष्ठं पपुरि शरवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra jyeṣṭhaṃ na ā bharanojiṣṭhaṃ papuri śravaḥ |
Translation: 5 O Indra, bring us name and fame, enriching, mightiest, excellent,

Sanskit Text: येनेमे चित्र वज्रहस्त रोदसी ओभे सुशिप्र पराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yeneme citra vajrahasta rodasī obhe suśipra prāḥ ||
Translation: Wherewith, O Wondrous God, fair-visored, thunder-armed, thou hast filled full this earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: तवामुग्रमवसे चर्षणीसहं राजन देवेषु हूमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmughramavase carṣaṇīsahaṃ rājan deveṣu hūmahe |
Translation: 6 We call on thee, O King, Mighty amid the Gods, Ruler of men, to succour us.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा सु नो विथुरा पिब्दना वसो.अमित्रान सुषहान कर्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā su no vithurā pibdanā vaso.amitrān suṣahān kṛdhi ||
Translation: All that is weak in us, Excellent God, make firm: make our foes easy to subdue.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्र नाहुषीष्वानोजो नर्म्णं च कर्ष्टिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindra nāhuṣīṣvānojo nṛmṇaṃ ca kṛṣṭiṣu |
Translation: 7 All strength and valour that is found, Indra, in tribes of Nahusas, and all the splendid fame that the Five Tribes enjoy

Sanskit Text: यद वापञ्च कषितीनां दयुम्नमा भर सत्रा विश्वानि पौंस्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vāpañca kṣitīnāṃ dyumnamā bhara satrā viśvāni pauṃsyā ||
Translation: Bring, yea, all manly powers at once.

Sanskit Text: यद वा तर्क्षौ मघवन दरुह्यावा जने यत पूरौ कच्च वर्ष्ण्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā tṛkṣau maghavan druhyāvā jane yat pūrau kacca vṛṣṇyam |
Translation: 8 Or, Maghavan, what vigorous strength in Trksi lay, in Druhyus or in Paru's folk,

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं तद रिरीहि सं नर्षाह्ये.अमित्रान पर्त्सुतुर्वणे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ tad rirīhi saṃ nṛṣāhye.amitrān pṛtsuturvaṇe ||
Translation: Fully bestow on us, that, in the conquering fray, we may subdue our foes in fight.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र तरिधातु शरणं तरिवरूथं सवस्तिमत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra tridhātu śaraṇaṃ trivarūthaṃ svastimat |
Translation: 9 O Indra, grant a happy home, a triple refuge triply strong.

Sanskit Text: छर्दिर्यछ मघवद्भ्यश्च मह्यं च यावया दिद्युमेभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: chardiryacha maghavadbhyaśca mahyaṃ ca yāvayā didyumebhyaḥ ||
Translation: Bestow a dwelling-place on the rich lords and me, and keep thy dart afar from these.

Sanskit Text: ये गव्यता मनसा शत्रुमादभुरभिप्रघ्नन्ति धर्ष्णुया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye ghavyatā manasā śatrumādabhurabhipraghnanti dhṛṣṇuyā |
Translation: 10 They who with minds intent on spoil subdue the foe, boldly attack and smite him down,—

Sanskit Text: अध समा नो मघवन्निन्द्र गिर्वणस्तनूपा अन्तमो भव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha smā no maghavannindra ghirvaṇastanūpā antamo bhava ||
Translation: From these, O Indra Maghavan who lovest song, be closest guardian of our lives.

Sanskit Text: अध समा नो वर्धे भवेन्द्र नायमवा युधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha smā no vṛdhe bhavendra nāyamavā yudhi |
Translation: 11 And now, O Indra, strengthen us: come near and aid us in the fight,

Sanskit Text: यदन्तरिक्षेपतयन्ति पर्णिनो दिद्यवस्तिग्ममूर्धानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadantarikṣepatayanti parṇino didyavastighmamūrdhānaḥ ||
Translation: What time the feathered shafts are flying in the air, the arrows with their sharpened points.

Sanskit Text: यत्र शूरासस्तन्वो वितन्वते परिया शर्म पितॄणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatra śūrāsastanvo vitanvate priyā śarma pitṝṇām |
Translation: 12 Give us, where heroes strain their bodies in the fight, the shelter that our fathers loved.

Sanskit Text: अध समा यछ तन्वे तने च छर्दिरचित्तं यावय दवेषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha smā yacha tanve tane ca chardiracittaṃ yāvaya dveṣaḥ ||
Translation: To us and to our sons give refuge: keep afar all unobserved hostility.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्र सर्गे अर्वतश्चोदयासे महाधने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindra sarghe arvataścodayāse mahādhane |
Translation: 13 When, Indra, in the mighty fray thou urgest chargers to their speed,

Sanskit Text: असमने अध्वनिव्र्जिने पथि शयेनानिव शरवस्यतह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asamane adhvanivṛjine pathi śyenāniva śravasyatah ||
Translation: On the uneven road and on a toilsome path, like falcons, eager for renown,

Sanskit Text: सिन्धून्रिव परवण आशुया यतो यदि कलोशमनु षवणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sindhūnriva pravaṇa āśuyā yato yadi klośamanu ṣvaṇi |
Translation: 14 Speeding like rivers rushing down a steep descent, responsive to the urging call,

Sanskit Text: आ ये वयो न वर्व्र्तत्यामिषि गर्भीता बाह्वोर्गवि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ye vayo na varvṛtatyāmiṣi ghṛbhītā bāhvorghavi ||
Translation: That come like birds attracted to the bait, held in by reins in both the driver's hands.

Sanskit Text: सवादुष किलायं मधुमानुतायं तीव्रः किलायं रसवानुतायम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāduṣ kilāyaṃ madhumānutāyaṃ tīvraḥ kilāyaṃ rasavānutāyam |
Translation: 1. YEA, this is good to taste and full of. sweetness, verily it is strong and rich in flavour.

Sanskit Text: उतो नवस्य पपिवांसमिन्द्रं न कश्चनसहत आहवेषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto nvasya papivāṃsamindraṃ na kaścanasahata āhaveṣu ||
Translation: No one may conquer Indra in the battle when he hath drunken of the draught we offer.

Sanskit Text: अयं सवादुरिह मदिष्ठ आस यस्येन्द्रो वर्त्रहत्ये ममाद |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ svāduriha madiṣṭha āsa yasyendro vṛtrahatye mamāda |
Translation: 2 This sweet juice here had mightiest power to gladden: it boldened Indra when he siaughtered Vṛtra,

Sanskit Text: पुरूणि यश्च्यौत्ना शम्बरस्य वि नवतिं नव च देह्यो हन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purūṇi yaścyautnā śambarasya vi navatiṃ nava ca dehyo han ||
Translation: When he defeated Śambara's many onslaughts, and battered down his nineand ninety ramparts.

Sanskit Text: अयं मे पीत उदियर्ति वचमयं मनीषामुशतीमजीगः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ me pīta udiyarti vacamayaṃ manīṣāmuśatīmajīghaḥ |
Translation: 3 This stirreth up my voice when I have drunk it: this hath aroused from sleep my yearning spirit.

Sanskit Text: अयं षळ उर्वीरमिमीत धीरो न याभ्यो भुवनं कच्चनारे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ ṣaḷ urvīramimīta dhīro na yābhyo bhuvanaṃ kaccanāre ||
Translation: This Sage hath measured out the six expanses from which no single creature is excluded.

Sanskit Text: अयं स यो वरिमाणं पर्थिव्या वर्ष्माणं दिवो अक्र्णोदयं सः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ sa yo varimāṇaṃ pṛthivyā varṣmāṇaṃ divo akṛṇodayaṃ saḥ |
Translation: 4 This, even this, is he who hath created the breadth of earth, the lofty height of heaven.

Sanskit Text: अयं पीयूषं तिस्र्षु परवत्सु सोमो दाधारोर्वन्तरिक्षम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ pīyūṣaṃ tisṛṣu pravatsu somo dādhārorvantarikṣam ||
Translation: He formed the nectar in three headlong rivers. Soma supports the wide mid-air above us.

Sanskit Text: अयं विदच्चित्रद्र्शीकमर्णः शुक्रसद्मनामुषसामनीके |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ vidaccitradṛśīkamarṇaḥ śukrasadmanāmuṣasāmanīke |
Translation: 5 He found the wavy sea of brilliant colours in forefront of the Dawns who dwell in brightness.

Sanskit Text: अयं महान महता सकम्भनेनोद दयामस्तभ्नाद वर्षभोमरुत्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ mahān mahatā skambhanenod dyāmastabhnād vṛṣabhomarutvān ||
Translation: This Mighty One, the Steer begirt by Maruts, hath propped the heavens up with a mighty pillar.

Sanskit Text: धर्षत पिब कलशे सोममिन्द्र वर्त्रहा शूर समरे वसूनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhṛṣat piba kalaśe somamindra vṛtrahā śūra samare vasūnām |
Translation: 6 Drink Soma boldly from the beaker, Indra, in war for treasures, Hero, Vṛtra-slayer!

Sanskit Text: माध्यन्दिने सवन आ वर्षस्व रयिस्थानो रयिमस्मासु धेहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mādhyandine savana ā vṛṣasva rayisthāno rayimasmāsu dhehi ||
Translation: Fill thyself full at the mid-day libation, and give us wealth, thou Treasury of riches.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र पर णः पुरेतेव पश्य पर नो नय परतरं वस्यो अछ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra pra ṇaḥ puraeteva paśya pra no naya prataraṃ vasyo acha |
Translation: 7 Look out for us, O Indra, as our Leader, and guide us on to gain yet goodlier treasure.

Sanskit Text: भवा सुपारो अतिपारयो नो भवा सुनीतिरुत वामनीतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhavā supāro atipārayo no bhavā sunītiruta vāmanītiḥ ||
Translation: Excellent Guardian, bear us well through peril, and lead us on to wealth with careful guidance.

Sanskit Text: उरुं नो लोकमनु नेषि विद्वान सवर्वज्ज्योतिरभयं सवस्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uruṃ no lokamanu neṣi vidvān svarvajjyotirabhayaṃ svasti |
Translation: 8 Lead us to ample room, O thou who knowest, to happiness, security, and sunlight.

Sanskit Text: रष्वा त इन्द्र सथविरस्य बाहू उप सथेयाम शरणा बर्हन्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṣvā ta indra sthavirasya bāhū upa stheyāma śaraṇā bṛhantā ||
Translation: High, Indra, are the arms of thee the Mighty: may we betake. us to their lofty shelter.

Sanskit Text: वरिष्ठे न इन्द्र वन्धुरे धा वहिष्ठयोः शतावन्नश्वयोरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: variṣṭhe na indra vandhure dhā vahiṣṭhayoḥ śatāvannaśvayorā |
Translation: 9 Set us on widest chariot-seat, O Indra, with two steeds best to draw, O Lord of Hundreds!

Sanskit Text: इषमा वक्षीषां वर्षिष्ठां मा नस्तारीन मघवन रायो अर्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣamā vakṣīṣāṃ varṣiṣṭhāṃ mā nastārīn maghavan rāyo aryaḥ ||
Translation: Bring us the best among all sorts of viands: let not the foe's wealth, Maghavan, subdue us.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र मर्ळ मह्यं जीवातुमिछ चोदय धियमयसो न धाराम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra mṛḷa mahyaṃ jīvātumicha codaya dhiyamayaso na dhārām |
Translation: 10 Be gracious, Indra, let my days be lengthened: sharpen my thought as ’twere a blade of iron

Sanskit Text: यत किं चाहं तवायुरिदं वदामि तज्जुषस्व कर्धि मा देववन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat kiṃ cāhaṃ tvāyuridaṃ vadāmi tajjuṣasva kṛdhi mā devavantam ||
Translation: Approve whatever words I speak, dependent on thee, and grant me thy divine protection.

Sanskit Text: तरातारमिन्द्रमवितारमिन्द्रं हवे-हवे सुहवं शूरमिन्द्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trātāramindramavitāramindraṃ have-have suhavaṃ śūramindram |
Translation: 11 Indra the Rescuer, Indra the Helper, Hero who listens at each invocation,

Sanskit Text: हवयामि शक्रं पुरुहूतमिन्द्रं सवस्ति नो मघवाधात्विन्द्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hvayāmi śakraṃ puruhūtamindraṃ svasti no maghavādhātvindraḥ ||
Translation: Śakra I call, Indra invoked of many. May Indra Maghavan prosper and bless us.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रः सुत्रामा सववानवोभिः सुम्र्ळीको भवतु विश्ववेदाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraḥ sutrāmā svavānavobhiḥ sumṛḷīko bhavatu viśvavedāḥ |
Translation: 12 May helpful Indra as our good Protector, Lord of all treasures, favour us with succour,

Sanskit Text: बाधतां दवेषो अभयं कर्णोतु सुवीर्यस्य पतयः सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bādhatāṃ dveṣo abhayaṃ kṛṇotu suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma ||
Translation: Baffle our foes, and give us rest and safety, and may we be the lords of hero vigour.

Sanskit Text: तस्य वयं सुमतौ यज्ञियस्यापि भद्रे सौमनसे सयाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma |
Translation: 13 May we enjoy the grace of him the Holy, yea, may we dwell in his auspicious favour.

Sanskit Text: स सुत्रामा सववानिन्द्रो अस्मे आराच्चिद दवेषः सनुतर्युयोतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sutrāmā svavānindro asme ārāccid dveṣaḥ sanutaryuyotu ||
Translation: May helpful Indra as our good Preserver drive from us, even from afar, our foemen.

Sanskit Text: अव तवे इन्द्र परवतो नोर्मिर्गिरो बरह्माणि नियुतो धवन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava tve indra pravato normirghiro brahmāṇi niyuto dhavante |
Translation: 14 Like rivers rushing down a slope, O Indra, to thee haste songs and prayers and linked verses.

Sanskit Text: उरू न राधः सवना पुरूण्यपो गा वज्रिन युवसे समिन्दून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: urū na rādhaḥ savanā purūṇyapo ghā vajrin yuvase samindūn ||
Translation: Thou gatherest, Thunderer! like widespread bounty, kine, water, drops, and manifold libations.

Sanskit Text: क ईं सतवत कः पर्णात को यजाते यदुग्रमिन मघवा विश्वहावेत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ka īṃ stavat kaḥ pṛṇāt ko yajāte yadughramin maghavā viśvahāvet |
Translation: 15 Who lauds him, satisfies him, pays him worship? E’en the rich noble still hath found him mighty.

Sanskit Text: पादाविव परहरन्नन्यम-अन्यं कर्णोति पूर्वमपरं शचीभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pādāviva praharannanyam-anyaṃ kṛṇoti pūrvamaparaṃ śacībhiḥ ||
Translation: With power, as when one moves his feet alternate, he makes the last precede, the foremost follow.

Sanskit Text: शर्ण्वे वीर उग्रम-उग्रं दमायन्नन्यम अन्यमतिनेनीयमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇve vīra ughram-ughraṃ damāyannanyam anyamatinenīyamānaḥ |
Translation: 16 Famed is the Hero as each strong man's tamer, ever advancing one and then another.

Sanskit Text: एधमानद्विळ उभयस्य राजा चोष्कूयते विश इन्द्रो मनुष्यान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: edhamānadviḷ ubhayasya rājā coṣkūyate viśa indro manuṣyān ||
Translation: King of both worlds, hating the high and haughty, Indra protects the men who are his people.

Sanskit Text: परा पूर्वेषां सख्या वर्णक्ति वितर्तुराणो अपरेभिरेति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parā pūrveṣāṃ sakhyā vṛṇakti vitarturāṇo aparebhireti |
Translation: 17 He loves no more the men he loved aforetime: he turns and moves away allied with others.

Sanskit Text: अनानुभूतीरवधून्वानः पूर्वीरिन्द्रः शरदस्तर्तरीति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anānubhūtīravadhūnvānaḥ pūrvīrindraḥ śaradastartarīti ||
Translation: Rejecting those who disregard his worship, Indra victorious lives through many autumns.

Sanskit Text: रूपं-रूपं परतिरूपो बभूव तदस्य रूपं परतिचक्षणाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rūpaṃ-rūpaṃ pratirūpo babhūva tadasya rūpaṃ praticakṣaṇāya |
Translation: 18 In every figure he hath been the mode: this is his only form for us to look on.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो मायाभिः पुरुरूप ईयते युक्ता हयस्य हरयःशता दश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro māyābhiḥ pururūpa īyate yuktā hyasya harayaḥśatā daśa ||
Translation: Indra moves multiform by his illusions; for his Bay Steeds are yoked, ten times a hundred.

Sanskit Text: युजानो हरिता रथे भूरि तवष्टेह राजति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yujāno haritā rathe bhūri tvaṣṭeha rājati |
Translation: 19 Here Tvaṣṭar, yoking to the car the Bay Steeds, hath extended sway.

Sanskit Text: को विश्वाहा दविषतः पक्ष आसत उतासीनेषु सूरिषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko viśvāhā dviṣataḥ pakṣa āsata utāsīneṣu sūriṣu ||
Translation: Who will for ever stand upon the foeman's side, even when our princes sit at ease?

Sanskit Text: अगव्यूति कषेत्रमागम्न देवा उर्वी सती भूमिरंहूरणाभूत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghavyūti kṣetramāghamna devā urvī satī bhūmiraṃhūraṇābhūt |
Translation: 20 Gods, we have reached a country void of pasture the land, though spacious, was too small to hold us.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पते पर चिकित्सा गविष्टावित्था सते जरित्रैन्द्र पन्थाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspate pra cikitsā ghaviṣṭāvitthā sate jaritraindra panthām ||
Translation: Bṛhaspati, provide in war for cattle; find a path, Indra, for this faithful singer.

Sanskit Text: दिवे-दिवे सद्र्शीरन्यमर्धं कर्ष्णा असेधतप सद्मनोजाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dive-dive sadṛśīranyamardhaṃ kṛṣṇā asedhatapa sadmanojāḥ |
Translation: 21 Day after day far from their seat he drove them, alike, from place to place, those darksome creatures.

Sanskit Text: अहन दासा वर्षभो वस्नयन्तोदव्रजे वर्चिनं शम्बरं च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahan dāsā vṛṣabho vasnayantodavraje varcinaṃ śambaraṃ ca ||
Translation: The Hero slew the meanly-huckstering Dāsas, Varcin and Śambara, where the waters gather.

Sanskit Text: परस्तोक इन नु राधसस्त इन्द्र दश कोशयीर्दश वाजिनो.अदात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prastoka in nu rādhasasta indra daśa kośayīrdaśa vājino.adāt |
Translation: 22 Out of thy bounty, Indra, hath Prastoka bestowed ten coffers and ten mettled horses.

Sanskit Text: दिवोदासादतिथिग्वस्य राधः शाम्बरं वसु परत्यग्रभीष्म ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divodāsādatithighvasya rādhaḥ śāmbaraṃ vasu pratyaghrabhīṣma ||
Translation: We have received in turn from Divodāsa Śambara's wealth, the gift of Atithigva.

Sanskit Text: दशाश्वान दश कोशान दश वस्त्राधिभोजना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśāśvān daśa kośān daśa vastrādhibhojanā |
Translation: 23 Ten horses and ten treasure-chests, ten garments as an added gift,

Sanskit Text: दशो हिरण्यपिण्डान दिवोदासादसानिषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśo hiraṇyapiṇḍān divodāsādasāniṣam ||
Translation: These and ten lumps of gold have I received from Divodāsa's hand.

Sanskit Text: दश रथान परष्टिमतः शतं गा अथर्वभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśa rathān praṣṭimataḥ śataṃ ghā atharvabhyaḥ |
Translation: 24 Ten cars with extra steed to each, for the Atharvans hundred cows,

Sanskit Text: अश्वथः पायवे.अदात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvathaḥ pāyave.adāt ||
Translation: Hath Asvatha to Payu given.

Sanskit Text: महि राधो विश्वजन्यं दधानान भरद्वाजान सार्ञ्जयो अभ्ययष्ट ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahi rādho viśvajanyaṃ dadhānān bharadvājān sārñjayo abhyayaṣṭa ||
Translation: 25 Thus Sṛñjaya's son honoured the Bharadvājas, recipients of all noble gifts and bounty.

Sanskit Text: वनस्पते वीड्वङगो हि भूया अस्मत्सखा परतरणः सुवीरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanaspate vīḍvaṅgho hi bhūyā asmatsakhā prataraṇaḥ suvīraḥ |
Translation: 26 Lord of the wood, be firm and strong in body: be, bearing us, a brave victorious hero

Sanskit Text: गोभिः संनद्धो असि वीळयस्वास्थाता ते जयतु जेत्वानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghobhiḥ saṃnaddho asi vīḷayasvāsthātā te jayatu jetvāni ||
Translation: Show forth thy strength, compact with straps of leather, and let thy rider win all spoils of battle.

Sanskit Text: दिवस पर्थिव्याः पर्योज उद्भ्र्तं वनस्पतिभ्यः पर्याभ्र्तं सहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divas pṛthivyāḥ paryoja udbhṛtaṃ vanaspatibhyaḥ paryābhṛtaṃ sahaḥ |
Translation: 27 Its mighty strength was borrowed from the heaven and earth: its conquering force was brought from sovrans of the wood.

Sanskit Text: अपामोज्मानं परि गोभिराव्र्तमिन्द्रस्य वज्रं हविषा रथं यज ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāmojmānaṃ pari ghobhirāvṛtamindrasya vajraṃ haviṣā rathaṃ yaja ||
Translation: Honour with holy gifts the Car like Indra's bolt, the Car bound round with straps, the vigour of the floods.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य वज्रो मरुतामनीकं मित्रस्य गर्भो वरुणस्य नाभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya vajro marutāmanīkaṃ mitrasya gharbho varuṇasya nābhiḥ |
Translation: 28 Thou Bolt of Indra, Vanguard of the Maruts, close knit to Varuṇa and Child of Mitra,—

Sanskit Text: सेमां नो हव्यदातिं जुषाणो देव रथ परति हव्या गर्भाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: semāṃ no havyadātiṃ juṣāṇo deva ratha prati havyā ghṛbhāya ||
Translation: As such, accepting gifts which here we offer, receive, O Godlike Chariot, these oblations.

Sanskit Text: उप शवासय पर्थिवीमुत दयां पुरुत्रा ते मनुतां विष्ठितं जगत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa śvāsaya pṛthivīmuta dyāṃ purutrā te manutāṃ viṣṭhitaṃ jaghat |
Translation: 29 Send forth thy voice aloud through earth and heaven, and let the world in all its breadth regard thee;

Sanskit Text: स दुन्दुभे सजूरिन्द्रेण देवैर्दूराद दवीयोप सेध शत्रून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa dundubhe sajūrindreṇa devairdūrād davīyoapa sedha śatrūn ||
Translation: O Drum, accordant with the Gods and Indra, drive thou afar, yea, very far, our foemen.

Sanskit Text: आ करन्दय बलमोजो न आ धा नि षटनिहि दुरिता बाधमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā krandaya balamojo na ā dhā ni ṣṭanihi duritā bādhamānaḥ |
Translation: 30 Thunder out strength and fill us full of vigour: yea, thunder forth and drive away all dangers.

Sanskit Text: अप परोथ दुन्दुभे दुछुना इत इन्द्रस्य मुष्टिरसि वीळयस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa protha dundubhe duchunā ita indrasya muṣṭirasi vīḷayasva ||
Translation: Drive hence, O War-drum, drive away misfortune: thou art the Fist of Indra: show thy firmness.

Sanskit Text: आमूरज परत्यावर्तयेमाः केतुमद दुन्दुभिर्वावदीति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āmūraja pratyāvartayemāḥ ketumad dundubhirvāvadīti |
Translation: 31 Drive hither those, and these again bring hither: the War-drum speaks aloud as battle's signal.

Sanskit Text: समश्वपर्णाश्चरन्ति नो नरो.अस्माकमिन्द्र रथिनो जयन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samaśvaparṇāścaranti no naro.asmākamindra rathino jayantu ||
Translation: Our heroes, winged with horses, come together. Let our car-warriors, Indra, be triumphant.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञा-यज्ञा वो अग्नये गिरा-गिरा च दक्षसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñā-yajñā vo aghnaye ghirā-ghirā ca dakṣase |
Translation: 1. SING to your Agni with each song, at every sacrifice, for strength.

Sanskit Text: पर-पर वयमम्र्तं जातवेदसं परियं मित्रं न शंसिषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra-pra vayamamṛtaṃ jātavedasaṃ priyaṃ mitraṃ na śaṃsiṣam ||
Translation: Come, let us praise the Wise and Everlasting God, even as a well-beloved Friend,

Sanskit Text: ऊर्जो नपातं स हिनायमस्मयुर्दाशेम हव्यदातये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrjo napātaṃ sa hināyamasmayurdāśema havyadātaye |
Translation: 2 The Son of Strength; for is he not our gracious Lord? Let us serve him who bears our gifts.

Sanskit Text: भुवद वाजेष्वविता भुवद वर्ध उत तराता तनूनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhuvad vājeṣvavitā bhuvad vṛdha uta trātā tanūnām ||
Translation: In battle may he be our help and strengthener, yea, be the saviour of our lives.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा हयग्ने अजरो महान विभास्यर्चिषा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā hyaghne ajaro mahān vibhāsyarciṣā |
Translation: 3 Agni, thou beamest forth with light, great Hero, never changed by time.

Sanskit Text: अजस्रेण शोचिषा शोशुचच्छुचे सुदीतिभिः सु दीदिहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajasreṇa śociṣā śośucacchuce sudītibhiḥ su dīdihi ||
Translation: Shining, pure Agni! with a light that never fades, beam with thy fair beams brilliantly.

Sanskit Text: महो देवान यजसि यक्ष्यानुषक तव करत्वोत दंसना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: maho devān yajasi yakṣyānuṣak tava kratvota daṃsanā |
Translation: 4 Thou worshippest great Gods: bring them without delay by wisdom and thy wondrous power.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाचः सीं कर्णुह्यग्ने.अवसे रास्व वाजोत वंस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvācaḥ sīṃ kṛṇuhyaghne.avase rāsva vājota vaṃsva ||
Translation: O Agni, make them turn hither to succour us. Give strength, and win it for thyself.

Sanskit Text: यमापो अद्रयो वना गर्भं रतस्य पिप्रति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamāpo adrayo vanā gharbhaṃ ṛtasya piprati |
Translation: 5 He whom floods, stones, and trees support, the offspring of eternal Law;

Sanskit Text: सहसा यो मथितो जायते नर्भिः पर्थिव्या अधि सानवि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasā yo mathito jāyate nṛbhiḥ pṛthivyā adhi sānavi ||
Translation: He who when rubbed with force is brought to life by men upon the lofty height of earth;

Sanskit Text: आ यः पप्रौ भानुना रोदसी उभे धूमेन धावते दिवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yaḥ paprau bhānunā rodasī ubhe dhūmena dhāvate divi |
Translation: 6 He who hath filled both worlds fult with his brilliant shine, who hastens with his smoke to heaven;

Sanskit Text: तिरस्तमो दद्र्श ऊर्म्यास्वा शयावास्वरुषो वर्षा शयावा अरुषो वर्षा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tirastamo dadṛśa ūrmyāsvā śyāvāsvaruṣo vṛṣā śyāvā aruṣo vṛṣā ||
Translation: He made himself apparent through the gloom by night, the Red Bull in the darksome nights, the Red Bull in the darksome nights.

Sanskit Text: बर्हद्भिरग्ने अर्चिभिः शुक्रेण देव शोचिषा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhadbhiraghne arcibhiḥ śukreṇa deva śociṣā |
Translation: 7 O Agni, with thy lofty beams, with thy pure brilliancy, O God,

Sanskit Text: भरद्वाजे समिधानो यविष्ठ्य रेवन नः शुक्र दीदिहि दयुमत पावक दीदिहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharadvāje samidhāno yaviṣṭhya revan naḥ śukra dīdihi dyumat pāvaka dīdihi ||
Translation: Kindled, Most Youthful One! by Bharadvāja's hand, shine on us, O pure God, with wealth, shine, Purifier! splendidly.

Sanskit Text: विश्वासां गर्हपतिर्विशामसि तवमग्ने मानुषीणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāsāṃ ghṛhapatirviśāmasi tvamaghne mānuṣīṇām |
Translation: 8 Thou art the Lord of house and home of all the tribes, O Agni, of all tribes of men.

Sanskit Text: शतं पूर्भिर्यविष्ठ पाह्यंहसः समेद्धारं शतं हिमा सतोत्र्भ्यो ये च ददति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ pūrbhiryaviṣṭha pāhyaṃhasaḥ sameddhāraṃ śataṃ himā stotṛbhyo ye ca dadati ||
Translation: Guard with a hundred forts thy kindler from distress, through hundred winters, Youngest God! and those who make thy singers rich.

Sanskit Text: तवं नश्चित्र ऊत्या वसो राधांसि चोदय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ naścitra ūtyā vaso rādhāṃsi codaya |
Translation: 9 Wonderful, with thy favouring help, send us thy bounties, gracious Lord.

Sanskit Text: अस्य रायस्त्वमग्ने रथीरसि विदा गाधं तुचे तु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya rāyastvamaghne rathīrasi vidā ghādhaṃ tuce tu naḥ ||
Translation: Thou art the Charioteer, Agni, of earthly wealth: find rest and safety for our seed.

Sanskit Text: पर्षि तोकं तनयं पर्त्र्भिष टवमदब्धैरप्रयुत्वभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parṣi tokaṃ tanayaṃ partṛbhiṣ ṭvamadabdhairaprayutvabhiḥ |
Translation: 10 With guards unfailing never negligent speed thou our children and our progeny.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने हेळांसि दैव्या युयोधि नो.अदेवानि हवरांसि च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne heḷāṃsi daivyā yuyodhi no.adevāni hvarāṃsi ca ||
Translation: Keep far from us, O Agni, all celestial wrath and wickedness of godless men.

Sanskit Text: आ सखायः सबर्दुघां धेनुमजध्वमुप नव्यसा वचः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā sakhāyaḥ sabardughāṃ dhenumajadhvamupa navyasā vacaḥ |
Translation: 11 Hither, O friends, with newest song drive her who freely pours her milk;

Sanskit Text: सर्जध्वमनपस्फुराम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sṛjadhvamanapasphurām ||
Translation: Loose her who never turns away;

Sanskit Text: या शर्धाय मारुताय सवभानवे शरवो.अम्र्त्यु धुक्षत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā śardhāya mārutāya svabhānave śravo.amṛtyu dhukṣata |
Translation: 12 Who, for the host of Maruts bright with native sheen, hath shed immortal fame like milk;

Sanskit Text: या मर्ळीके मरुतां तुराणां या सुम्नैरेवयावरी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā mṛḷīke marutāṃ turāṇāṃ yā sumnairevayāvarī ||
Translation: Whom the impetuous Maruts look upon with love, who moves in splendour on their ways.

Sanskit Text: भरद्वाजायाव धुक्षत दविता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharadvājāyāva dhukṣata dvitā |
Translation: 13 For Bharadvāja she poured down in days of old

Sanskit Text: धेनुं च विश्वदोहसमिषं च विश्वभोजसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhenuṃ ca viśvadohasamiṣaṃ ca viśvabhojasam ||
Translation: The milch-cow yielding milk for all, and food that gives all nourishment.

Sanskit Text: तं व इन्द्रं न सुक्रतुं वरुणमिव मायिनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ va indraṃ na sukratuṃ varuṇamiva māyinam |
Translation: 14 Your friend like Indra passing wise, with magic power like Varuṇa.

Sanskit Text: अर्यमणं न मन्द्रं सर्प्रभोजसं विष्णुं न सतुष आदिशे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aryamaṇaṃ na mandraṃ sṛprabhojasaṃ viṣṇuṃ na stuṣa ādiśe ||
Translation: Like Aryaman joy-giving, bringing plenteous food like ViSnxu for my wish, I praise,

Sanskit Text: तवेषं शर्धो न मारुतं तुविष्वण्यनर्वाणं पूषणं सं यथा शता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tveṣaṃ śardho na mārutaṃ tuviṣvaṇyanarvāṇaṃ pūṣaṇaṃ saṃ yathā śatā |
Translation: 15 Bright as the host of Maruts mighty in their roar. May they bring Pūṣan free from foes;

Sanskit Text: सं सहस्रा कारिषच्चर्षणिभ्य आनाविर्गूळ्हा वसू करत सुवेदा नो वसू करत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ sahasrā kāriṣaccarṣaṇibhya ānāvirghūḷhā vasū karat suvedā no vasū karat ||
Translation: May they bring hither hundreds, thousands for our men: may they bring hidden stores to light, and make wealth easy to be found.

Sanskit Text: आ मा पूषन्नुप दरव शंसिषं नु ते अपिकर्ण आघ्र्णे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā mā pūṣannupa drava śaṃsiṣaṃ nu te apikarṇa āghṛṇe |
Translation: 16 Haste to me, Pūṣan, in thine car, bright Deity: I fain would speak:

Sanskit Text: अघा अर्यो अरातयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghā aryo arātayaḥ ||
Translation: Most sinful is our foeman's hate.

Sanskit Text: मा काकम्बीरमुद वर्हो वनस्पतिमशस्तीर्वि हि नीनशः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā kākambīramud vṛho vanaspatimaśastīrvi hi nīnaśaḥ |
Translation: 17 Tear not up by the roots the Kakambira tree: destroy thou all malignity.

Sanskit Text: मोत सूरो अह एवा चन गरीवा आदधते वेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mota sūro aha evā cana ghrīvā ādadhate veḥ ||
Translation: Let them not snare by day the neck of that Celestial Bird the Sun.

Sanskit Text: दर्तेरिव ते.अव्र्कमस्तु सख्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dṛteriva te.avṛkamastu sakhyam |
Translation: 18 Uninjured let thy friendship be, like the smooth surface of a skin,

Sanskit Text: अछिद्रस्य दधन्वतः सुपूर्णस्य दधन्वतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: achidrasya dadhanvataḥ supūrṇasya dadhanvataḥ ||
Translation: A flawless skin, containing curds, full to the mouth, containing curds.

Sanskit Text: परो हि मर्त्यैरसि समो देवैरुत शरिया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: paro hi martyairasi samo devairuta śriyā |
Translation: 19 For thou art high above mankind, in glory equal to the Gods.

Sanskit Text: अभि खयः पूषन पर्तनासु नस्त्वमवा नूनं यथा पुरा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi khyaḥ pūṣan pṛtanāsu nastvamavā nūnaṃ yathā purā ||
Translation: Therefore, O Pūṣan, look upon us in the fight: now help us as in days of old.

Sanskit Text: वामी वामस्य धूतयः परणीतिरस्तु सून्र्ता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāmī vāmasya dhūtayaḥ praṇītirastu sūnṛtā |
Translation: 20 May the kind excellence of him the Kind, loud Roarers! be our guide,

Sanskit Text: देवस्य वामरुतो मर्त्यस्य वेजानस्य परयज्यवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devasya vāmaruto martyasya vejānasya prayajyavaḥ ||
Translation: Be it the God's, O Maruts, or a mortal man's who worships, ye impetuous Ones!

Sanskit Text: सद्यश्चिद यस्य चर्क्र्तिः परि दयां देवो नैति सूर्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadyaścid yasya carkṛtiḥ pari dyāṃ devo naiti sūryaḥ |
Translation: 21 They whose high glory in a moment like the God, the Sun, goes round the space of heaven,

Sanskit Text: तवेषं शवो दधिरे नाम यज्ञियं मरुतो वर्त्रहं शवो जयेष्ठं वर्त्रहं शवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tveṣaṃ śavo dadhire nāma yajñiyaṃ maruto vṛtrahaṃ śavo jyeṣṭhaṃ vṛtrahaṃ śavaḥ ||
Translation: The Maruts have obtained bright strength, a sacred name, strength that destroys the Vṛtras, strength Vṛtra-destroying excellent.

Sanskit Text: सक्र्द ध दयौरजायत सक्र्द भूमिरजायत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakṛd dha dyaurajāyata sakṛd bhūmirajāyata |
Translation: 22 Once, only once, the heaven was made, once only once, the earth was formed-

Sanskit Text: पर्श्न्या दुग्धं सक्र्त पयस्तदन्यो नानु जायते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛśnyā dughdhaṃ sakṛt payastadanyo nānu jāyate ||
Translation: Once, only Pṛśni's milk was shed: no second, after this, is born.

Sanskit Text: सतुषे जनं सुव्रतं नव्यसीभिर्गीर्भिर्मित्रावरुणा सुम्नयन्ता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stuṣe janaṃ suvrataṃ navyasībhirghīrbhirmitrāvaruṇā sumnayantā |
Translation: 1. I LAUD with newest songs the Righteous People, Mitra and Varuṇa who make us happy.

Sanskit Text: त आ गमन्तु त इह शरुवन्तु सुक्षत्रासो वरुणोमित्रो अग्निः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta ā ghamantu ta iha śruvantu sukṣatrāso varuṇomitro aghniḥ ||
Translation: Let them approach, here let them listen,Agni, Varuṇa, Mitra, Lords of fair dominion.

Sanskit Text: विशो-विश ईड्यमध्वरेष्वद्र्प्तक्रतुमरतिं युवत्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśo-viśa īḍyamadhvareṣvadṛptakratumaratiṃ yuvatyoḥ |
Translation: 2 Him, to be praised at each tribe's sacrifices, the Two young Matrons' sober-minded Herald,

Sanskit Text: दिवः शिशुं सहसः सूनुमग्निं यज्ञस्य केतुमरुषं यजध्यै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divaḥ śiśuṃ sahasaḥ sūnumaghniṃ yajñasya ketumaruṣaṃ yajadhyai ||
Translation: The Son of Strength, the Child of Heaven, the signal of sacrifice, red Agni will I worship.

Sanskit Text: अरुषस्य दुहितरा विरूपे सत्र्भिरन्या पिपिशे सूरो अन्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aruṣasya duhitarā virūpe stṛbhiranyā pipiśe sūro anyā |
Translation: 3 Unlike in form are the Red God's two Daughters: one is the Sun's, and stars bedeck the other.

Sanskit Text: मिथस्तुरा विचरन्ती पावके मन्म शरुतं नक्षत रच्यमाने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mithasturā vicarantī pāvake manma śrutaṃ nakṣata ṛcyamāne ||
Translation: Apart, the Sanctifiers, in succession, come to the famed hymn, praised in holy verses.

Sanskit Text: पर वायुमछा बर्हती मनीषा बर्हद्रयिं विश्ववारं रथप्राम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vāyumachā bṛhatī manīṣā bṛhadrayiṃ viśvavāraṃ rathaprām |
Translation: 4 I with a lofty song call hither Vāyu, all-bounteous, filler of his car, most wealthy.

Sanskit Text: दयुतद्यामा नियुतः पत्यमानः कविः कविमियक्षसि परयज्यो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyutadyāmā niyutaḥ patyamānaḥ kaviḥ kavimiyakṣasi prayajyo ||
Translation: Thou, Sage, with bright path, Lord of harnessed horses, impetuous, promptly honourest the prudent.

Sanskit Text: स मे वपुश्छदयदश्विनोर्यो रथो विरुक्मान मनसा युजानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa me vapuśchadayadaśvinoryo ratho virukmān manasā yujānaḥ |
Translation: 5 That chariot of the Aśvins, fair to look on, pleaseth me well, yoked with a thought, refulgent,

Sanskit Text: येन नरा नासत्येषयध्यै वर्तिर्याथस्तनयाय तमने च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena narā nāsatyeṣayadhyai vartiryāthastanayāya tmane ca ||
Translation: Wherewith, Nāsatyas, Chiefs, ye seek our dwelling, to give new strength to us and to our children.

Sanskit Text: पर्जन्यवाता वर्षभा पर्थिव्याः पुरीषाणि जिन्वतमप्यानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parjanyavātā vṛṣabhā pṛthivyāḥ purīṣāṇi jinvatamapyāni |
Translation: 6 Bulls of the Earth, O Vāta and Parjanya, stir up for us the regions of the water.

Sanskit Text: सत्यश्रुतः कवयो यस्य गीर्भिर्जगत सथातर्जगदाक्र्णुध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satyaśrutaḥ kavayo yasya ghīrbhirjaghata sthātarjaghadākṛṇudhvam ||
Translation: Hearers of truth, ye, Sages, World-Supporters, increase his living wealth whose songs delight you.

Sanskit Text: पावीरवी कन्या चित्रायुः सरस्वती वीरपत्नी धियं धात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāvīravī kanyā citrāyuḥ sarasvatī vīrapatnī dhiyaṃ dhāt |
Translation: 7 So may Sarasvatī, the Hero's Consort, brisk with rare life, the lightning's Child, inspire us,

Sanskit Text: गनाभिरछिद्रं शरणं सजोषा दुराधर्षं गर्णते शर्म यंसत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghnābhirachidraṃ śaraṇaṃ sajoṣā durādharṣaṃ ghṛṇate śarma yaṃsat ||
Translation: And, with the Dames accordant, give the singer a refuge unassailable and flawless.

Sanskit Text: पथस-पथः परिपतिं वचस्या कामेन कर्तो अभ्यानळ अर्कम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pathas-pathaḥ paripatiṃ vacasyā kāmena kṛto abhyānaḷ arkam |
Translation: 8 I praise with eloquence him who guards all pathways. He, when his love impelled him, went to Arka.

Sanskit Text: स नो रासच्छुरुधश्चन्द्राग्रा धियं-धियं सीषधाति पर पूषा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no rāsacchurudhaścandrāghrā dhiyaṃ-dhiyaṃ sīṣadhāti pra pūṣā ||
Translation: May he vouchsafe us gear with gold to grace it: may Pūṣan make each prayer of ours efective.

Sanskit Text: परथमभाजं यशसं वयोधां सुपाणिं देवं सुगभस्तिं रभ्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prathamabhājaṃ yaśasaṃ vayodhāṃ supāṇiṃ devaṃ sughabhastiṃ ṛbhvam |
Translation: 9 May Herald Agni, fulgent, bring for worship Tvaṣṭar adored, in homes and swift to listen,

Sanskit Text: होता यक्षद यजतं पस्त्यानामग्निस्त्वष्टारं सुहवं विभावा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotā yakṣad yajataṃ pastyānāmaghnistvaṣṭāraṃ suhavaṃ vibhāvā ||
Translation: Glorious, first to share, the life-bestower, the ever active God, fair-armed, fair-handed.

Sanskit Text: भुवनस्य पितरं गीर्भिराभी रुद्रं दिवा वर्धया रुद्रमक्तौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhuvanasya pitaraṃ ghīrbhirābhī rudraṃ divā vardhayā rudramaktau |
Translation: 10 Rudra by day, Rudra at night we honour with these our songs, the Universe's Father.

Sanskit Text: बर्हन्तं रष्वमजरं सुषुम्नं रधग घुवेम कविनेषितासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhantaṃ ṛṣvamajaraṃ suṣumnaṃ ṛdhagh ghuvema kavineṣitāsaḥ ||
Translation: Him great and lofty, blissful, undecaying let us call specially as the Sage impels us.

Sanskit Text: आ युवानः कवयो यज्ञियासो मरुतो गन्त गर्णतो वरस्याम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yuvānaḥ kavayo yajñiyāso maruto ghanta ghṛṇato varasyām |
Translation: 11 Ye who are youthful, wise, and meet for worship, come, Martits, to the longing of the singer.

Sanskit Text: अचित्रं चिद धि जिन्वथा वर्धन्त इत्था नक्षन्तो नरो अङगिरस्वत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: acitraṃ cid dhi jinvathā vṛdhanta itthā nakṣanto naro aṅghirasvat ||
Translation: Coming, as erst to Aṅgiras, O Heroes, ye animate and quicken e’en the desert.

Sanskit Text: पर वीराय पर तवसे तुरायाजा यूथेव पशुरक्षिरस्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vīrāya pra tavase turāyājā yūtheva paśurakṣirastam |
Translation: 12 Even as the herdsman driveth home his cattle, I urge my songs to him the strong swift Hero

Sanskit Text: स पिस्प्र्शति तन्वि शरुतस्य सत्र्भिर्न नाकं वचनस्यविपः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pispṛśati tanvi śrutasya stṛbhirna nākaṃ vacanasyavipaḥ ||
Translation: May he, the glorious, lay upon his body the singer's hymns, as stars bedeck the heaven.

Sanskit Text: यो रजांसि विममे पार्थिवानि तरिश्चिद विष्णुर्मनवे बाधिताय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo rajāṃsi vimame pārthivāni triścid viṣṇurmanave bādhitāya |
Translation: 13 He who for man's behoof in his afiliction thrice measured out the earthly regions, Viṣṇu-

Sanskit Text: तस्य ते शर्मन्नुपदद्यमाने राया मदेम तन्वा तना च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya te śarmannupadadyamāne rāyā madema tanvā tanā ca ||
Translation: When one so great as thou affordeth shelter, may we with wealth and with ourselves be happy.

Sanskit Text: तन नो.अहिर्बुध्न्यो अब्धिरर्कैस्तत पर्वतस्तत सविता चनो धात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no.ahirbudhnyo abdhirarkaistat parvatastat savitā cano dhāt |
Translation: 14 Sweet be this song of mine to Ahibudhnya, Parvata, Savitar, with Floods and Lightnings;

Sanskit Text: तदोषधीभिरभि रातिषाचो भगः पुरन्धिर्जिन्वतु पर राये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadoṣadhībhirabhi rātiṣāco bhaghaḥ purandhirjinvatu pra rāye ||
Translation: Sweet, with the Plants, to Gods who seek oblations. May liberal Bhaga speed us on to riches.

Sanskit Text: नु नो रयिं रथ्यं चर्षणिप्रां पुरुवीरं मह रतस्य गोपाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nu no rayiṃ rathyaṃ carṣaṇiprāṃ puruvīraṃ maha ṛtasya ghopām |
Translation: 15 Give riches borne on cars, with many heroes, contenting men, the guard of mighty Order.

Sanskit Text: कषयं दाताजरं येन जनान सप्र्धो अदेवीरभि चक्रमाम विश आदेवीरभ्यश्नवाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣayaṃ dātājaraṃ yena janān spṛdho adevīrabhi cakramāma viśa ādevīrabhyaśnavāma ||
Translation: Give us a lasting home that we may battle with godless bands of men who fight against us, and meet with tribes to whom the Gods are gracious.

Sanskit Text: हुवे वो देवीमदितिं नमोभिर्म्र्ळीकाय वरुणं मित्रमग्निम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: huve vo devīmaditiṃ namobhirmṛḷīkāya varuṇaṃ mitramaghnim |
Translation: 1. I CALL with prayers on Aditi your Goddess, on Agni, Mitra, Varuṇa for favour,

Sanskit Text: अभिक्षदामर्यमणं सुशेवं तरातॄन देवान सवितारं भगं च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhikṣadāmaryamaṇaṃ suśevaṃ trātṝn devān savitāraṃ bhaghaṃ ca ||
Translation: On Aryaman who gives unasked, the gracious, on Gods who save, on Savitar and Bhaga.

Sanskit Text: सुज्योतिषः सूर्य दक्षपितॄननागास्त्वे सुमहो वीहि देवान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sujyotiṣaḥ sūrya dakṣapitṝnanāghāstve sumaho vīhi devān |
Translation: 2 Visit, to prove us free from sin, O Sūrya Lord of great might, the bright Gods sprung from Dakṣa,

Sanskit Text: दविजन्मानो य रतसापः सत्याः सवर्वन्तो यजता अग्निजिह्वाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvijanmāno ya ṛtasāpaḥ satyāḥ svarvanto yajatā aghnijihvāḥ ||
Translation: Twice-born and true, observing sacred duties, Holy and full of light, whose tongue is Agni.

Sanskit Text: उत दयावाप्र्थिवी कषत्रमुरु बर्हद रोदसी शरणं सुषुम्ने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta dyāvāpṛthivī kṣatramuru bṛhad rodasī śaraṇaṃ suṣumne |
Translation: 3 And, O ye Heaven and Earth, a wide dominion, O ye most blissful Worlds, our lofty shelter,

Sanskit Text: महस करथो वरिवो यथा नो.अस्मे कषयाय धिषणे अनेहः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahas karatho varivo yathā no.asme kṣayāya dhiṣaṇe anehaḥ ||
Translation: Give ample room and freedom for our dwelling, a home, ye Hemispheres, which none may rival.

Sanskit Text: आ नो रुद्रस्य सूनवो नमन्तामद्या हूतासो वसवो.अध्र्ष्टाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no rudrasya sūnavo namantāmadyā hūtāso vasavo.adhṛṣṭāḥ |
Translation: 4 This day invited may the Sons of Rudra, resistless, excellent, stoop down to meet us;

Sanskit Text: यदीमर्भे महति वा हितासो बाधे मरुतो अह्वाम देवान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadīmarbhe mahati vā hitāso bādhe maruto ahvāma devān ||
Translation: For, when beset with slight or sore affliction, we ever call upon the Gods, the Maruts;

Sanskit Text: मिम्यक्ष येषु रोदसी नु देवी सिषक्ति पूषा अभ्यर्धयज्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mimyakṣa yeṣu rodasī nu devī siṣakti pūṣā abhyardhayajvā |
Translation: 5 To whom the Goddess Rodasī clings closely, whom Pūṣan follows bringing ample bounty.

Sanskit Text: शरुत्वा हवं मरुतो यद ध याथ भूमा रेजन्ते अध्वनि परविक्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrutvā havaṃ maruto yad dha yātha bhūmā rejante adhvani pravikte ||
Translation: What time ye hear our call and come, O Maruts, upon your separate path all creatures tremble.

Sanskit Text: अभि तयं वीरं गिर्वणसमर्चेन्द्रं बरह्मणा जरितर्नवेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tyaṃ vīraṃ ghirvaṇasamarcendraṃ brahmaṇā jaritarnavena |
Translation: 6 With a new hymn extol, O thou who singest, the Lover of the Song, the Hero Indra.

Sanskit Text: शरवदिद धवमुप च सतवानो रासद वाजानुप महो गर्णानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śravadid dhavamupa ca stavāno rāsad vājānupa maho ghṛṇānaḥ ||
Translation: May he, exalted, hear our invocation, and grant us mighty wealth and strength when lauded.

Sanskit Text: ओमानमापो मानुषीरम्र्क्तं धात तोकाय तनयाय शंयोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: omānamāpo mānuṣīramṛktaṃ dhāta tokāya tanayāya śaṃyoḥ |
Translation: 7 Give full protection, Friends of man, ye Waters, in peace and trouble, to our sons and grandsons.

Sanskit Text: यूयं हि षठा भिषजो मात्र्तमा विश्वस्य सथातुर्जगतो जनित्रीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā bhiṣajo mātṛtamā viśvasya sthāturjaghato janitrīḥ ||
Translation: For ye are our most motherly physicians, parents of all that standeth, all that moveth.

Sanskit Text: आ नो देवः सविता तरायमाणो हिरण्यपाणिर्यजतो जगम्यात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no devaḥ savitā trāyamāṇo hiraṇyapāṇiryajato jaghamyāt |
Translation: 8 May Savitar come hither and approach us, the God who rescues, Holy, goldenhanded,

Sanskit Text: यो दत्रवानुषसो न परतीकं वयूर्णुते दाशुषे वार्याणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo datravānuṣaso na pratīkaṃ vyūrṇute dāśuṣe vāryāṇi ||
Translation: The God who, bounteous as the face of Morning, discloses precious gifts for him who worships.

Sanskit Text: उत तवं सूनो सहसो नो अद्या देवानस्मिन्नध्वरे वव्र्त्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tvaṃ sūno sahaso no adyā devānasminnadhvare vavṛtyāḥ |
Translation: 9 And thou, O Son of Strength, do thou turn hither the Gods to-day to this our holy service.

Sanskit Text: सयामहं ते सदमिद रातौ तव सयामग्ने.अवसा सुवीरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: syāmahaṃ te sadamid rātau tava syāmaghne.avasā suvīraḥ ||
Translation: May I for evermore enjoy thy bounty and, Agni, by thy grace be rich in heroes.

Sanskit Text: उत तया मे हवमा जग्म्यातं नासत्या धीभिर्युवमङग विप्रा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tyā me havamā jaghmyātaṃ nāsatyā dhībhiryuvamaṅgha viprā |
Translation: 10 Come also to my call, O ye Nāsatyas, yea, verily, through my prayers, ye Holy Sages.

Sanskit Text: अत्रिं न महस्तमसो.अमुमुक्तं तूर्वतं नरा दुरितादभीके ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atriṃ na mahastamaso.amumuktaṃ tūrvataṃ narā duritādabhīke ||
Translation: As from great darkness ye delivered Atri, protect us, Chiefs, from danger in the conflict.

Sanskit Text: ते नो रायो दयुमतो वाजवतो दातारो भूत नर्वतः पुरुक्षोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te no rāyo dyumato vājavato dātāro bhūta nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ |
Translation: 11 O Gods, bestow upon us riches, splendid with strength and heroes, bringing food in plenty.

Sanskit Text: दशस्यन्तो दिव्याः पार्थिवासो गोजाता अप्या मर्लता चदेवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśasyanto divyāḥ pārthivāso ghojātā apyā mṛlatā cadevāḥ ||
Translation: Be gracious, helpful Gods of earth, of heaven, born of the Cow, and dwellers in the waters.

Sanskit Text: ते नो रुद्रः सरस्वती सजोषा मीळ्हुष्मन्तो विष्णुर्म्र्ळन्तु वायुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te no rudraḥ sarasvatī sajoṣā mīḷhuṣmanto viṣṇurmṛḷantu vāyuḥ |
Translation: 12 May Rudra and Sarasvatī, accordant, Viṣṇu and Vāyu, pour down gifts and bless us;

Sanskit Text: रभुक्षा वाजो दैव्यो विधाता पर्जन्यावाता पिप्यतामिषं नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛbhukṣā vājo daivyo vidhātā parjanyāvātā pipyatāmiṣaṃ naḥ ||
Translation: Ṛbhukṣan, Vāja, and divine Vidhatar, Parjanya, Vāta make our food abundant.

Sanskit Text: उत सय देवः सविता भगो नो.अपां नपादवतु दानु पप्रिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta sya devaḥ savitā bhagho no.apāṃ napādavatu dānu papriḥ |
Translation: 13 May this God Savitar, the Lord, the Offspring of Waters, pouring down his dew be gracious,

Sanskit Text: तवष्टा देवेभिर्जनिभिः सजोषा दयौर्देवेभिः पर्थिवी समुद्रैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṣṭā devebhirjanibhiḥ sajoṣā dyaurdevebhiḥ pṛthivī samudraiḥ ||
Translation: And, with the Gods and Dames accordant, Tvaṣṭar; Dyaus with the Gods and Prthivi with oceans.

Sanskit Text: उत नो.अहिर्बुध्न्यः शर्णोत्वज एकपात पर्थिवी समुद्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta no.ahirbudhnyaḥ śṛṇotvaja ekapāt pṛthivī samudraḥ |
Translation: 14 May Aja-Ekapād and Ahibudhnya, and Earth and Ocean hear our invocation;

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवा रताव्र्धो हुवाना सतुता मन्त्राः कविशस्ता अवन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devā ṛtāvṛdho huvānā stutā mantrāḥ kaviśastā avantu ||
Translation: All Gods who strengthen Law, invoked and lauded, and holy texts uttered by sages, help us.

Sanskit Text: एवा नपातो मम तस्य धीभिर्भरद्वाजा अभ्यर्चन्त्यर्कैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā napāto mama tasya dhībhirbharadvājā abhyarcantyarkaiḥ |
Translation: 15 So with my thoughts and hymns of praise the children of Bharadvāja sing aloud to please you.

Sanskit Text: गना हुतासो वसवो.अध्र्ष्टा विश्वे सतुतासो भूता यजत्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghnā hutāso vasavo.adhṛṣṭā viśve stutāso bhūtā yajatrāḥ ||
Translation: The Dames invoked, and the resistless Vasus, and all ye Holy Ones have been exalted.

Sanskit Text: उदु तयच्चक्षुर्महि मित्रयोरानेति परियं वरुणयोरदब्धम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udu tyaccakṣurmahi mitrayorāneti priyaṃ varuṇayoradabdham |
Translation: 1. THAT mighty eye of Varuṇa and Mitra, infallible and dear, is moving upward.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य शुचि दर्शतमनीकं रुक्मो न दिव उदिताव्यद्यौत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya śuci darśatamanīkaṃ rukmo na diva uditāvyadyaut ||
Translation: The pure and lovely face of holy Order hath shone like gold of heaven in its arising.

Sanskit Text: वेद यस्त्रीणि विदथान्येषां देवानां जन्म सनुतरा च विप्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: veda yastrīṇi vidathānyeṣāṃ devānāṃ janma sanutarā ca vipraḥ |
Translation: 2 The Sage who knows these Gods’ three ranks and orders, and all their generations near and distant,

Sanskit Text: रजु मर्तेषु वर्जिना च पश्यन्नभि चष्टे सूरो अर्य एवान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā ca paśyannabhi caṣṭe sūro arya evān ||
Translation: Beholding good and evil acts of mortals, Sūra marks well the doing of the pious.

Sanskit Text: सतुष उ वो मह रतस्य गोपानदितिं मित्रं वरुणं सुजातान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stuṣa u vo maha ṛtasya ghopānaditiṃ mitraṃ varuṇaṃ sujātān |
Translation: 3 I praise you Guards of mighty Law eternal, Aditi, Mitra, Varuṇa, the noble,

Sanskit Text: अर्यमणं भगमदब्धधीतीनछा वोचे सधन्यः पावकान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aryamaṇaṃ bhaghamadabdhadhītīnachā voce sadhanyaḥ pāvakān ||
Translation: Aryaman, Bhaga, all whose thoughts are faithful: hither I call the Bright who share in common.

Sanskit Text: रिशादसः सत्पतीन्रदब्धान महो राज्ञः सुवसनस्य दातॄन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: riśādasaḥ satpatīnradabdhān maho rājñaḥ suvasanasya dātṝn |
Translation: 4 Lords of the brave, infallible, foe-destroyers, great Kings, bestowers of fair homes to dwell in,

Sanskit Text: यूनः सुक्षत्रान कषयतो दिवो नॄनादित्यान याम्यदितिं दुवोयु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūnaḥ sukṣatrān kṣayato divo nṝnādityān yāmyaditiṃ duvoyu ||
Translation: Young, Heroes, ruling heaven with strong dominion, Ādityas, Aditi I seek with worship.

Sanskit Text: दयौष पितः पर्थिवि मातरध्रुगग्ने भरातर्वसवो मर्ळता नः |
