Sanskrit Transliteration: dyauṣ pitaḥ pṛthivi mātaradhrughaghne bhrātarvasavo mṛḷatā naḥ |
Translation: 5 O Heaven our Father, Earth our guileless Mother, O Brother Agni, and ye Vasus, bless us.

Sanskit Text: विश्व आदित्या अदिते सजोषा अस्मभ्यं शर्म बहुलं वि यन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśva ādityā adite sajoṣā asmabhyaṃ śarma bahulaṃ vi yanta ||
Translation: Grant us, O Aditi and ye Ādityas, all of one mind, your manifold protection.

Sanskit Text: मा नो वर्काय वर्क्ये समस्मा अघायते रीरधता यजत्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no vṛkāya vṛkye samasmā aghāyate rīradhatā yajatrāḥ |
Translation: 6 Give us not up to any evil creature, as spoil to wolf or she-wolf, O ye Holy.

Sanskit Text: यूयं हि षठा रथ्यो नस्तनूनां यूयं दक्षस्य वचसो बभूव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā rathyo nastanūnāṃ yūyaṃ dakṣasya vacaso babhūva ||
Translation: For ye are they who guide aright our bodies, ye are the rulers of our speech and vigour.

Sanskit Text: मा व एनो अन्यक्र्तं भुजेम मा तत कर्म वसवो यच्चयध्वे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā va eno anyakṛtaṃ bhujema mā tat karma vasavo yaccayadhve |
Translation: 7 Let us not suffer for the sin of others, nor do the deed which ye, O Vasus, punish.

Sanskit Text: विश्वस्य हि कषयथ विश्वदेवाः सवयं रिपुस्तन्वं रीरिषीष्ट ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvasya hi kṣayatha viśvadevāḥ svayaṃ ripustanvaṃ rīriṣīṣṭa ||
Translation: Ye, Universal Gods! are all-controllers: may he do harm unto himself who hates Me.

Sanskit Text: नम इदुग्रं नम आ विवासे नमो दाधार पर्थिवीमुत दयाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nama idughraṃ nama ā vivāse namo dādhāra pṛthivīmuta dyām |
Translation: 8 Mighty is homage: I adopt and use it. Homage hath held in place the earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: नमो देवेभ्यो नम ईश एषां कर्तं चिदेनो नमसाविवासे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: namo devebhyo nama īśa eṣāṃ kṛtaṃ cideno namasāvivāse ||
Translation: Homage to Gods! Homage commands and rules them. I banish even committed sin by homage

Sanskit Text: रतस्य वो रथ्यः पूतदक्षान रतस्य पस्त्यसदो अदब्धान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya vo rathyaḥ pūtadakṣān ṛtasya pastyasado adabdhān |
Translation: 9 You Furtherers of Law, pure in your spirit, infallible, dwellers in the home of Order,

Sanskit Text: ताना नमोभिरुरुचक्षसो नॄन विश्वान व आ नमे महो यजत्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tānā namobhirurucakṣaso nṝn viśvān va ā name maho yajatrāḥ ||
Translation: To you all Heroes mighty and far-seeing I bow me down, O Holy Ones, with homage.

Sanskit Text: ते हि शरेष्ठवर्चसस्त उ नस्तिरो विश्वानि दुरिता नयन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te hi śreṣṭhavarcasasta u nastiro viśvāni duritā nayanti |
Translation: 10 For these are they who shine with noblest splendour; through all our troubles these conduct us safely-

Sanskit Text: सुक्षत्रासो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निरतधीतयो वक्मराजसत्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sukṣatrāso varuṇo mitro aghnirtadhītayo vakmarājasatyāḥ ||
Translation: Varuṇa, Mitra, Agni, mighty Rulers, trueminded, faithful to the hymn's controllers.

Sanskit Text: ते न इन्द्रः पर्थिवी कषाम वर्धन पूषा भगो अदितिः पञ्च जनाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te na indraḥ pṛthivī kṣāma vardhan pūṣā bhagho aditiḥ pañca janāḥ |
Translation: 11 May they, Earth, Aditi, Indra, Bhaga, Pūṣan increase our laud, increase the Fivefold people.

Sanskit Text: सुशर्माणः सववसः सुनीथा भवन्तु नःसुत्रात्रासः सुगोपाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suśarmāṇaḥ svavasaḥ sunīthā bhavantu naḥsutrātrāsaḥ sughopāḥ ||
Translation: Giving good help, good refuge, goodly guidance, be they our good deliverers, good protectors.

Sanskit Text: नू सद्मानं दिव्यं नंशि देवा भारद्वाजः सुमतिं याति होता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū sadmānaṃ divyaṃ naṃśi devā bhāradvājaḥ sumatiṃ yāti hotā |
Translation: 12 Come now, O Gods, to your celestial station: the Bharadvājas' priest entreats your favour.

Sanskit Text: आसानेभिर्यजमानो मियेधैर्देवानां जन्म वसूयुर्ववन्द ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsānebhiryajamāno miyedhairdevānāṃ janma vasūyurvavanda ||
Translation: He, sacrificing, fain for wealth, hath honoured the Gods vath those who sit and share oblations.

Sanskit Text: अप तयं वर्जिनं रिपुं सतेनमग्ने दुराध्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa tyaṃ vṛjinaṃ ripuṃ stenamaghne durādhyam |
Translation: 13 Agni, drive thou the wicked foe, the evil-hearted thief away,

Sanskit Text: दविष्ठमस्य सत्पते कर्धी सुगम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: daviṣṭhamasya satpate kṛdhī sugham ||
Translation: Far, far, Lord of the brave I and give us easy paths.

Sanskit Text: गरावाणः सोम नो हि कं सखित्वनाय वावशुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghrāvāṇaḥ soma no hi kaṃ sakhitvanāya vāvaśuḥ |
Translation: 14 Soma, these pressing-stones have called aloud to win thee for our Friend.

Sanskit Text: जही नयत्रिणं पणिं वर्को हि षः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jahī nyatriṇaṃ paṇiṃ vṛko hi ṣaḥ ||
Translation: Destroy the greedy Paṇi, for a wolf is he.

Sanskit Text: यूयं हि षठा सुदानव इन्द्रज्येष्ठा अभिद्यवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā sudānava indrajyeṣṭhā abhidyavaḥ |
Translation: 15 Ye, O most bountiful, are they who, led by Indra, seek the sky.

Sanskit Text: कर्ता नो अध्वन्ना सुगं गोपा अमा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kartā no adhvannā sughaṃ ghopā amā ||
Translation: Give us good paths for travel: guard us ivell at home.

Sanskit Text: अपि पन्थामगन्महि सवस्तिगामनेहसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: api panthāmaghanmahi svastighāmanehasam |
Translation: 16 Now have we entered on the road that leads to bliss, without a foe,

Sanskit Text: येन विश्वाः परिद्विषो वर्णक्ति विन्दते वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena viśvāḥ paridviṣo vṛṇakti vindate vasu ||
Translation: The road whereon a man escapes all enemies and gathers wealth.

Sanskit Text: न तद दिवा न पर्थिव्यानु मन्ये न यज्ञेन नोत शमीभिराभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na tad divā na pṛthivyānu manye na yajñena nota śamībhirābhiḥ |
Translation: 1. THIS I allow not in the earth or heaven, at sacrifice or in these holy duties.

Sanskit Text: उब्जन्तु तं सुभ्वः पर्वतासो नि हीयतामतियाजस्य यष्टा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubjantu taṃ subhvaḥ parvatāso ni hīyatāmatiyājasya yaṣṭā ||
Translation: May the huge mountains crush him down: degraded be Atiyaja's sacrificing patron.

Sanskit Text: अति वा यो मरुतो मन्यते नो बरह्म वा यः करियमाणं निनित्सात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ati vā yo maruto manyate no brahma vā yaḥ kriyamāṇaṃ ninitsāt |
Translation: 2 Or he who holds us in contempt, O Maruts, or seeks to blame the prayer that we are making,

Sanskit Text: तपूंषि तस्मै वर्जिनानि सन्तु बरह्मद्विषमभि तं शोचतु दयौः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tapūṃṣi tasmai vṛjināni santu brahmadviṣamabhi taṃ śocatu dyauḥ ||
Translation: May agonies of burning be his portion. May the sky scorch the man who hates devotion.

Sanskit Text: किमङग तवा बरह्मणः सोम गोपां किमङग तवाहुरभिशस्तिपां नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kimaṅgha tvā brahmaṇaḥ soma ghopāṃ kimaṅgha tvāhurabhiśastipāṃ naḥ |
Translation: 3 Why then, O Soma, do they call thee keeper of prayer? Why then our guardian from reproaches?

Sanskit Text: किमङग नः पश्यसि निद्यमानान बरह्मद्विषे तपुषिं हेतिमस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kimaṅgha naḥ paśyasi nidyamānān brahmadviṣe tapuṣiṃ hetimasya ||
Translation: Why then beholdest thou how men revile us? Cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion.

Sanskit Text: अवन्तु मामुषसो जायमाना अवन्तु मा सिन्धवः पिन्वमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avantu māmuṣaso jāyamānā avantu mā sindhavaḥ pinvamānāḥ |
Translation: 4 May Mornings as they spring to life, protect me, and may the Rivers as they swell preserve me.

Sanskit Text: अवन्तु मा पर्वतासो धरुवासो.अवन्तु मा पितरो देवहूतौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avantu mā parvatāso dhruvāso.avantu mā pitaro devahūtau ||
Translation: My guardians be the firmly-seated mountains: the Fathers, when I call on Gods, defend me!

Sanskit Text: विश्वदानीं सुमनसः सयाम पश्येम नु सूर्यमुच्चरन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvadānīṃ sumanasaḥ syāma paśyema nu sūryamuccarantam |
Translation: 5 Through all our days may we be healthy. minded, and look upon the Sun when he arises.

Sanskit Text: तथा करद वसुपतिर्वसूनां देवानोहानो.अवसागमिष्ठः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tathā karad vasupatirvasūnāṃ devānohāno.avasāghamiṣṭhaḥ ||
Translation: Grant this the Treasure-Lord of treasures, coming, observant, oftenest of Gods, with succour!

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो नेदिष्ठमवसागमिष्ठः सरस्वती सिन्धुभिः पिन्वमाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro nediṣṭhamavasāghamiṣṭhaḥ sarasvatī sindhubhiḥ pinvamānā |
Translation: 6 Most near, most oft comes Indra with protection, and she Sarasvatī, who swells with rivers -

Sanskit Text: पर्जन्यो न ओषधीभिर्मयोभुरग्निः सुशंसः सुहवः पितेव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parjanyo na oṣadhībhirmayobhuraghniḥ suśaṃsaḥ suhavaḥ piteva ||
Translation: Parjanya, bringing health with herbs, and Agni, well lauded swift to listen, like a father.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवास आ गत शर्णुता म इमं हवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devāsa ā ghata śṛṇutā ma imaṃ havam |
Translation: 7 Hear this mine invocation; come hither, O Universal Gods,

Sanskit Text: एदं बर्हिर्नि षीदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: edaṃ barhirni ṣīdata ||
Translation: Be seated on this holy grass.

Sanskit Text: यो वो देवा घर्तस्नुना हव्येन परतिभूषति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vo devā ghṛtasnunā havyena pratibhūṣati |
Translation: 8 To him who comes to meet you, Gods, with offerings bathed in holy oil-

Sanskit Text: तं विश्व उप गछथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ viśva upa ghachatha ||
Translation: Approach ye, one and all, to him.

Sanskit Text: उप नः सूनवो गिरः शर्ण्वन्त्वम्र्तस्य ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa naḥ sūnavo ghiraḥ śṛṇvantvamṛtasya ye |
Translation: 9 All Sons of Immortality shall listen to the songs we sing,

Sanskit Text: सुम्र्ळीका भवन्तु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sumṛḷīkā bhavantu naḥ ||
Translation: And be exceeding good to us.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवा रताव्र्ध रतुभिर्हवनश्रुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devā ṛtāvṛdha ṛtubhirhavanaśrutaḥ |
Translation: 10 May all the Gods who strengthen Law, with Ṛtus, listening to our call,

Sanskit Text: जुषन्तां युज्यं पयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣantāṃ yujyaṃ payaḥ ||
Translation: Be pleased with theit appropriate draught.

Sanskit Text: सतोत्रमिन्द्रो मरुद्गणस्त्वष्ट्र्मान मित्रो अर्यमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stotramindro marudghaṇastvaṣṭṛmān mitro aryamā |
Translation: 11 May Indra, with the Marut host, with Tvaṣṭar, Mitra, Aryaman,

Sanskit Text: इमा हव्या जुषन्त नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā havyā juṣanta naḥ ||
Translation: Accept the laud and these our gifts.

Sanskit Text: इमं नो अग्ने अध्वरं होतर्वयुनशो यज |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ no aghne adhvaraṃ hotarvayunaśo yaja |
Translation: 12 O Agni, Priest, as rules ordain, offer this sacrifice of ours,

Sanskit Text: चिकित्वान दैव्यं जनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cikitvān daivyaṃ janam ||
Translation: Remembering the Heavenly Folk.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवाः शर्णुतेमं हवं मे ये अन्तरिक्षे य उप दयवि षठ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devāḥ śṛṇutemaṃ havaṃ me ye antarikṣe ya upa dyavi ṣṭha |
Translation: 13 Listen, All-Gods, to this mine invocation, Ye who inhabit heaven, and air's midregions,

Sanskit Text: ये अग्निजिह्वा उत वा यजत्रा आसद्यास्मिन बर्हिषि मादयध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye aghnijihvā uta vā yajatrā āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam ||
Translation: All ye, O Holy Ones, whose tongue is Agni, seated upon this sacred grass, be joyful.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवा मम शर्ण्वन्तु यज्ञिया उभे रोदसी अपां नपाच्च मन्म |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devā mama śṛṇvantu yajñiyā ubhe rodasī apāṃ napācca manma |
Translation: 14 May the All-Gods who claim our worship hear my thought; may the two World-halves hear it, and the Waters’ Child.

Sanskit Text: मा वो वचांसि परिचक्ष्याणि वोचं सुम्नेष्विद वो अन्तमा मदेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā vo vacāṃsi paricakṣyāṇi vocaṃ sumneṣvid vo antamā madema ||
Translation: Let me not utter words that ye may disregard. Closely allied with you may we rejoice in bliss.

Sanskit Text: ये के च जमा महिनो अहिमाया दिवो जज्ञिरे अपां सधस्थे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye ke ca jmā mahino ahimāyā divo jajñire apāṃ sadhasthe |
Translation: 15 And those who, Mighty, with the wiles of serpents, were born on earth, in heaven, where waters gather-

Sanskit Text: ते अस्मभ्यमिषये विश्वमायुः कषप उस्रा वरिवस्यन्तुदेवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te asmabhyamiṣaye viśvamāyuḥ kṣapa usrā varivasyantudevāḥ ||
Translation: May they vouchsafe us life of full duration. May the Gods kindly give us nights and mornings.

Sanskit Text: अग्नीपर्जन्याववतं धियं मे.अस्मिन हवे सुहवा सुष्टुतिंनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnīparjanyāvavataṃ dhiyaṃ me.asmin have suhavā suṣṭutiṃnaḥ |
Translation: 16 At this my call, O Agni and Parjanya, help, swift to hear, my thought and our laudation.

Sanskit Text: इळामन्यो जनयद गर्भमन्यः परजावतीरिष आ धत्तमस्मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iḷāmanyo janayad gharbhamanyaḥ prajāvatīriṣa ā dhattamasme ||
Translation: One generates holy food, the other offspring, so grant us food enough with store of children.

Sanskit Text: सतीर्णे बर्हिषि समिधाने अग्नौ सूक्तेन महा नमसा विवासे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stīrṇe barhiṣi samidhāne aghnau sūktena mahā namasā vivāse |
Translation: 17 When holy grass is strewn and fire enkindled, with hymn and lowly homage I invite you.

Sanskit Text: अस्मिन नो अद्य विदथे यजत्रा विश्वे देवा हविषि मादयध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmin no adya vidathe yajatrā viśve devā haviṣi mādayadhvam ||
Translation: All-Gods, to day in this our great assembly rejoice, ye Holy, in the gifts we offer.

Sanskit Text: सं पूषन विदुषा नय यो अञ्जसानुशासति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ pūṣan viduṣā naya yo añjasānuśāsati |
Translation: 1. O PUSAN, bring us to the man who knows, who shall direct us straight,

Sanskit Text: य एवेदमिति बरवत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya evedamiti bravat ||
Translation: And say unto us, It is here.

Sanskit Text: समु पूष्णा गमेमहि यो गर्हानभिशासति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samu pūṣṇā ghamemahi yo ghṛhānabhiśāsati |
Translation: 2 May we go forth with Pūṣan who shall point the houses out to us,

Sanskit Text: इम एवेति चब्रवत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ima eveti cabravat ||
Translation: And say to us, These same are they.

Sanskit Text: पूष्णश्चक्रं न रिष्यति न कोशो.अव पद्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūṣṇaścakraṃ na riṣyati na kośo.ava padyate |
Translation: 3 Unharmed is Pūṣan's chariot wheel; the box ne’er falleth to the ground,

Sanskit Text: नो अस्य वयथते पविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: no asya vyathate paviḥ ||
Translation: Nor doth the loosened felIy shake.

Sanskit Text: यो अस्मै हविषाविधन न तं पूषापि मर्ष्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo asmai haviṣāvidhan na taṃ pūṣāpi mṛṣyate |
Translation: 4 Pūṣan forgetteth not the man who serveth him with offered gift:

Sanskit Text: परथमो विदते वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prathamo vidate vasu ||
Translation: That man is first to gather wealth.

Sanskit Text: पूषा गा अन्वेतु नः पुषा रक्षत्वर्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūṣā ghā anvetu naḥ puṣā rakṣatvarvataḥ |
Translation: 5 May Pūṣan follow near our kine; may Pūṣan keep our horses safe:

Sanskit Text: पूषा वाजं सनोतु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūṣā vājaṃ sanotu naḥ ||
Translation: May Pūṣan gather gear for us.

Sanskit Text: पूषन्ननु पर गा इहि यजमानस्य सुन्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūṣannanu pra ghā ihi yajamānasya sunvataḥ |
Translation: 6 Follow the kine of him who pours libations out and worships thee;

Sanskit Text: अस्माकं सतुवतामुत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākaṃ stuvatāmuta ||
Translation: And ours who sing thee songs of praise.

Sanskit Text: माकिर्नेशन माकीं रिषन माकीं सं शारि केवटे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mākirneśan mākīṃ riṣan mākīṃ saṃ śāri kevaṭe |
Translation: 7 Let none be lost, none injured, none sink in a pit and break a limb.

Sanskit Text: अथारिष्टाभिरा गहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athāriṣṭābhirā ghahi ||
Translation: Return with these all safe and sound.

Sanskit Text: शर्ण्वन्तं पूषणं वयमिर्यमनष्टवेदसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇvantaṃ pūṣaṇaṃ vayamiryamanaṣṭavedasam |
Translation: 8 Pūṣan who listens to our prayers, the Strong whose wealth is never lost,

Sanskit Text: ईशानंराय ईमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: īśānaṃrāya īmahe ||
Translation: The Lord of riches, we implore.

Sanskit Text: पूषन तव वरते वयं न रिष्येम कदा चन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūṣan tava vrate vayaṃ na riṣyema kadā cana |
Translation: 9 Secure in thy protecting care, O Pūṣan, never may we fail.

Sanskit Text: सतोतारस्त इह समसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stotārasta iha smasi ||
Translation: We here are they who sing thy praise.

Sanskit Text: परि पूषा परस्ताद धस्तं दधातु दक्षिणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari pūṣā parastād dhastaṃ dadhātu dakṣiṇam |
Translation: 10 From out the distance, far and wide, may Pūṣan stretch his right hand forth,

Sanskit Text: पुनर्नो नष्टमाजतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punarno naṣṭamājatu ||
Translation: And drive our lost again to us.

Sanskit Text: एहि वां विमुचो नपादाघ्र्णे सं सचावहै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ehi vāṃ vimuco napādāghṛṇe saṃ sacāvahai |
Translation: 1. SON of Deliverance, come, bright God!

Sanskit Text: रथीरतस्य नो भव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathīrtasya no bhava ||
Translation: Let us twain go together: be our charioteer of sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: रथीतमं कपर्दिनमीशानं राधसो महः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathītamaṃ kapardinamīśānaṃ rādhaso mahaḥ |
Translation: 2 We pray for wealth to thee most skilled of charioteers, with braided hair,

Sanskit Text: रायः सखायमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyaḥ sakhāyamīmahe ||
Translation: Lord of great riches, and our Friend.

Sanskit Text: रायो धारास्याघ्र्णे वसो राशिरजाश्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyo dhārāsyāghṛṇe vaso rāśirajāśva |
Translation: 3 Bright God whose steeds are goats, thou art a stream of wealth, a treasure-heap,

Sanskit Text: धीवतो-धीवतः सखा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhīvato-dhīvataḥ sakhā ||
Translation: The Friend of every pious man.

Sanskit Text: पूषणं नवजाश्वमुप सतोषाम वाजिनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūṣaṇaṃ nvajāśvamupa stoṣāma vājinam |
Translation: 4 Pūṣan, who driveth goats for steeds, the strong and Mighty, who is called

Sanskit Text: सवसुर्यो जार उच्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svasuryo jāra ucyate ||
Translation: His Sister's lover, will we laud.

Sanskit Text: मातुर्दिधिषुमब्रवं सवसुर्जारः शर्णोतु नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: māturdidhiṣumabravaṃ svasurjāraḥ śṛṇotu naḥ |
Translation: 5 His Mother's suitor I address. May he who loves his Sister hear,

Sanskit Text: भरातेन्द्रस्य सखा मम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhrātendrasya sakhā mama ||
Translation: Brother of Indra, and my Friend.

Sanskit Text: आजासः पूषणं रथे निश्र्म्भास्ते जनश्रियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ājāsaḥ pūṣaṇaṃ rathe niśṛmbhāste janaśriyam |
Translation: 6 May the sure-footed goats come nigh, conveying Pūṣan on his car,

Sanskit Text: देवं वहन्तु बिभ्रतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devaṃ vahantu bibhrataḥ ||
Translation: The God who visiteth mankind.

Sanskit Text: य एनमादिदेशति करम्भादिति पूषणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya enamādideśati karambhāditi pūṣaṇam |
Translation: 1. WHOSO remembers Pūṣan as cater of mingled curd and meal

Sanskit Text: न तेन देव आदिशे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na tena deva ādiśe ||
Translation: Need think no more upon the God.

Sanskit Text: उत घा स रथीतमः सख्या सत्पतिर्युजा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta ghā sa rathītamaḥ sakhyā satpatiryujā |
Translation: 2 And he is best of charioteers. Indra, the hero's Lord, allied

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो वर्त्राणि जिघ्नते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro vṛtrāṇi jighnate ||
Translation: With him as Friend, destroys the foes.

Sanskit Text: उतादः परुषे गवि सूरश्चक्रं हिरण्ययम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: utādaḥ paruṣe ghavi sūraścakraṃ hiraṇyayam |
Translation: 3 And there the best of charioteers hath guided through the speckled cloud

Sanskit Text: नयैरयद्रथीतमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nyairayadrathītamaḥ ||
Translation: The golden wheel of Sūra's car.

Sanskit Text: यदद्य तवा पुरुष्टुत बरवाम दस्र मन्तुमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadadya tvā puruṣṭuta bravāma dasra mantumaḥ |
Translation: 4 Whate’er we speak this day to thee, Wise, Wondrous God whom many praise,

Sanskit Text: तत सु नो मन्म साधय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat su no manma sādhaya ||
Translation: Give thou fulfilment of our thought.

Sanskit Text: इमं च नो गवेषणं सातये सीषधो गणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ ca no ghaveṣaṇaṃ sātaye sīṣadho ghaṇam |
Translation: 5 Lead on this company of ours, that longs for kine, to win the spoil:

Sanskit Text: आरात पूषन्नसि शरुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ārāt pūṣannasi śrutaḥ ||
Translation: Thou, Pūṣan, art renowned afar.

Sanskit Text: आ ते सवस्तिमीमह आरेघामुपावसुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā te svastimīmaha āreaghāmupāvasum |
Translation: 6 Prosperity we crave from thee, afar from sin and near to wealth,

Sanskit Text: अद्या च सर्वतातये शवश्च सर्वतातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adyā ca sarvatātaye śvaśca sarvatātaye ||
Translation: Tending to perfect happiness both for to. morrow and to-day.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रा नु पूषणा वयं सख्याय सवस्तये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrā nu pūṣaṇā vayaṃ sakhyāya svastaye |
Translation: 1. INDRA and Pūṣan will we call for friend ship and prosperity

Sanskit Text: हुवेम वाजसातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: huvema vājasātaye ||
Translation: And for the winning of the spoil.

Sanskit Text: सोममन्य उपासदत पातवे चम्वोः सुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somamanya upāsadat pātave camvoḥ sutam |
Translation: 2 One by the Soma sits to drink juice which the mortar hath expressed:

Sanskit Text: करम्भमन्य इछति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: karambhamanya ichati ||
Translation: The other longs for curd and meal.

Sanskit Text: अजा अन्यस्य वह्नयो हरी अन्यस्य सम्भ्र्ता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajā anyasya vahnayo harī anyasya sambhṛtā |
Translation: 3 Goats are the team that draws the one: the other hath Bay Steeds at hand;

Sanskit Text: ताभ्यां वर्त्राणि जिघ्नते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tābhyāṃ vṛtrāṇi jighnate ||
Translation: With both of these he slays the fiends.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्रो अनयद रितो महीरपो वर्षन्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindro anayad rito mahīrapo vṛṣantamaḥ |
Translation: 4 When Indra, wondrous strong, brought down the streams, the mighty waterfloods,

Sanskit Text: तत्र पूषाभवत सचा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tatra pūṣābhavat sacā ||
Translation: Pūṣan was standing by his side.

Sanskit Text: तां पूष्णः सुमतिं वयं वर्क्षस्य पर वयामिव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāṃ pūṣṇaḥ sumatiṃ vayaṃ vṛkṣasya pra vayāmiva |
Translation: 5 To this, to Pūṣan's favouring love, and Indra's, may we closely cling,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य चा रभामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya cā rabhāmahe ||
Translation: As to a tree's extended bough.

Sanskit Text: उत पूषणं युवामहे.अभीशून्रिव सारथिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut pūṣaṇaṃ yuvāmahe.abhīśūnriva sārathiḥ |
Translation: 6 As one who drives a car draws in his reins, may we draw Pūṣan near,

Sanskit Text: मह्या इन्द्रं सवस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahyā indraṃ svastaye ||
Translation: And Indra, for our great success.

Sanskit Text: शुक्रं ते अन्यद यजतं ते अन्यद विषुरूपे अहनी दयौरिवासि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śukraṃ te anyad yajataṃ te anyad viṣurūpe ahanī dyaurivāsi |
Translation: 1. LIKE heaven art thou: one form is bright, one holy, like Day and Night dissimilar in colour.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा हि माया अवसि सवधावो भद्रा ते पूषन्निहरातिरस्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā hi māyā avasi svadhāvo bhadrā te pūṣanniharātirastu ||
Translation: All magic powers thou aidest, self-depen. dent! Auspicious be thy bounty here, O Pūṣan.

Sanskit Text: अजाश्वः पशुपा वाजपस्त्यो धियंजिन्वो भुवने विश्वे अर्पितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajāśvaḥ paśupā vājapastyo dhiyaṃjinvo bhuvane viśve arpitaḥ |
Translation: 2 Goat-borne, the guard of cattle, he whose home is strength, inspirer of the hymn, set over all the world;

Sanskit Text: अष्ट्रां पूषा शिथिरामुद्वरीव्र्जत संचक्षाणोभुवना देव ईयते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṣṭrāṃ pūṣā śithirāmudvarīvṛjat saṃcakṣāṇobhuvanā deva īyate ||
Translation: Brandishing here and there his lightly. moving goad, beholding every creature, Pūṣan, God, goes forth.

Sanskit Text: यास्ते पूषन नावो अन्तः समुद्रे हिरण्ययीरन्तरिक्षे चरन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāste pūṣan nāvo antaḥ samudre hiraṇyayīrantarikṣe caranti |
Translation: 3 O Pūṣan, with thy golden ships that travel across the ocean, in the air's mid-region,

Sanskit Text: ताभिर्यासि दूत्यां सूर्यस्य कामेन कर्त शरव इछमानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tābhiryāsi dūtyāṃ sūryasya kāmena kṛta śrava ichamānaḥ ||
Translation: Thou goest on an embassy to Sūrya, subdued by love, desirous of the glory.

Sanskit Text: पूषा सुबन्धुर्दिव आ पर्थिव्या इळस पतिर्मघवा दस्मवर्चाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūṣā subandhurdiva ā pṛthivyā iḷas patirmaghavā dasmavarcāḥ |
Translation: 4 Near kinsman of the heaven and earth is Pūṣan, liberal, Lord of food, of wondrous iustre,

Sanskit Text: यं देवासो अददुः सूर्यायै कामेन कर्तं तवसं सवञ्चम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ devāso adaduḥ sūryāyai kāmena kṛtaṃ tavasaṃ svañcam ||
Translation: Whom strong and vigorous and swiftlymoving, subdued by love, the Deities gave to Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: पर नु वोचा सुतेषु वां वीर्या यानि चक्रथुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra nu vocā suteṣu vāṃ vīryā yāni cakrathuḥ |
Translation: 1. I WILL declare, while juices flow, the manly deeds that ye have done:

Sanskit Text: हतासो वां पितरो देवशत्रव इन्द्राग्नी जीवथो युवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hatāso vāṃ pitaro devaśatrava indrāghnī jīvatho yuvam ||
Translation: Your Fathers, enemies of Gods, were smitten down, and, Indra-Agni, ye survive.

Sanskit Text: बळ इत्था महिमा वामिन्द्राग्नी पनिष्ठ आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: baḷ itthā mahimā vāmindrāghnī paniṣṭha ā |
Translation: 2 Thus, Indra-Agnip verily your greatness merits loftiest praise,

Sanskit Text: समानो वां जनिता भरातरा युवं यमाविहेहमातरा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samāno vāṃ janitā bhrātarā yuvaṃ yamāvihehamātarā ||
Translation: Sprung from one common Father, brothers, twins are ye; your Mother is in every place.

Sanskit Text: ओकिवांसा सुते सचानश्वा सप्ती इवादने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: okivāṃsā sute sacānaśvā saptī ivādane |
Translation: 3 These who delight in flowing juice, like fellow horses at their food,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रा नवग्नी अवसेह वज्रिणा वयं देवा हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrā nvaghnī avaseha vajriṇā vayaṃ devā havāmahe ||
Translation: Indra and Agni, Gods armed with the thunderbolt, we call this day to come with help.

Sanskit Text: य इन्द्राग्नी सुतेषु वां सतवत तेष्व रताव्र्धा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya indrāghnī suteṣu vāṃ stavat teṣv ṛtāvṛdhā |
Translation: 4 Indra and Agni, Friends of Law, served with rich gifts, your speech is kind

Sanskit Text: जोषवाकं वदतः पज्रहोषिणा न देवा भसथश्चन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: joṣavākaṃ vadataḥ pajrahoṣiṇā na devā bhasathaścana ||
Translation: To him who praises you while these libations flow: that man, O Gods, ye ne’er consume.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी को अस्य वां देवौ मर्तश्चिकेतति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī ko asya vāṃ devau martaściketati |
Translation: 5 What mortal understands, O Gods, Indra and Agni, this your way?

Sanskit Text: विषूचो अश्वान युयुजान ईयत एकः समान आ रथे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viṣūco aśvān yuyujāna īyata ekaḥ samāna ā rathe ||
Translation: One of you, yoking Steeds that move to every side, advances in your common car.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी अपादियं पूर्वागात पद्वतीभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī apādiyaṃ pūrvāghāt padvatībhyaḥ |
Translation: 6 First, Indra-Agni, hath this Maid come footless unto those with feet.

Sanskit Text: हित्वी शिरो जिह्वया वावदच्चरत तरिंशत पदा नयक्रमीत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hitvī śiro jihvayā vāvadaccarat triṃśat padā nyakramīt ||
Translation: Stretching her head and speaking loudly with her tongue, she hath gone downward thirty steps.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी आ हि तन्वते नरो धन्वानि बाह्वोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī ā hi tanvate naro dhanvāni bāhvoḥ |
Translation: 7 E’en now, O Indra-Agni, men hold in their arms and stretch their bows.

Sanskit Text: मा नो अस्मिन महाधने परा वर्क्तं गविष्टिषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no asmin mahādhane parā varktaṃ ghaviṣṭiṣu ||
Translation: Desert us not in this great fray, in battles for the sake of kine.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी तपन्ति माघा अर्यो अरातयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī tapanti māghā aryo arātayaḥ |
Translation: 8 The foeman's sinful enmities, Indra and Agni, vex me sore.

Sanskit Text: अप दवेषांस्या कर्तं युयुतं सूर्यादधि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa dveṣāṃsyā kṛtaṃ yuyutaṃ sūryādadhi ||
Translation: Drive those who hate me far away, and keep them distant from the Sun.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी युवोरपि वसु दिव्यानि पार्थिवा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī yuvorapi vasu divyāni pārthivā |
Translation: 9 Indra and Agni, yours are all the treasures of the heavens and earth.

Sanskit Text: आ न इह परयछतं रयिं विश्वायुपोषसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā na iha prayachataṃ rayiṃ viśvāyupoṣasam ||
Translation: Here give ye us the opulence that prospers every living man.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी उक्थवाहसा सतोमेभिर्हवनश्रुता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī ukthavāhasā stomebhirhavanaśrutā |
Translation: 10 O Indra-Agni, who accept the laud, and hear us for our praise,

Sanskit Text: विश्वाभिर्गीर्भिरा गतमस्य सोमस्य पीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvābhirghīrbhirā ghatamasya somasya pītaye ||
Translation: Come near us, drawn by all our songs, to drink of this our Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: शनथद वर्त्रमुत सनोति वाजमिन्द्रा यो अग्नी सहुरी सपर्यात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śnathad vṛtramuta sanoti vājamindrā yo aghnī sahurī saparyāt |
Translation: 1. HE slays the foe and wins the spoil who worships Indra and Agni, strong and mighty Heroes,

Sanskit Text: इरज्यन्ता वसव्यस्य भूरेः सहस्तमा सहसा वाजयन्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: irajyantā vasavyasya bhūreḥ sahastamā sahasā vājayantā ||
Translation: Who rule as Sovrans over ample riches, victorious, showing forth their power in conquest.

Sanskit Text: ता योधिष्टमभि गा इन्द्र नूनमपः सवरुषसो अग्न ऊळ्हः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā yodhiṣṭamabhi ghā indra nūnamapaḥ svaruṣaso aghna ūḷhaḥ |
Translation: 2 So battle now, O Indra and thou, Agni, for cows and waters, sunlight, stolen Mornings.

Sanskit Text: दिशः सवरुषस इन्द्र चित्रा अपो गा अग्ने युवसे नियुत्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: diśaḥ svaruṣasa indra citrā apo ghā aghne yuvase niyutvān ||
Translation: Team-borne, thou makest kine thine own, O Agni: thou, Indra, light, Dawns, regions, wondrous waters.

Sanskit Text: आ वर्त्रहणा वर्त्रहभिः शुष्मैरिन्द्र यातं नमोभिरग्ने अर्वाक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vṛtrahaṇā vṛtrahabhiḥ śuṣmairindra yātaṃ namobhiraghne arvāk |
Translation: 3 With Vṛtra-slaying might, Indra and Agni, come, drawn by homage, O ye Vṛtra-slayers.

Sanskit Text: युवं राधोभिरकवेभिरिन्द्राग्ने अस्मे भवतमुत्तमेभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ rādhobhirakavebhirindrāghne asme bhavatamuttamebhiḥ ||
Translation: Indra and Agni, show yourselves among us with your supreme and unrestricted bounties.

Sanskit Text: ता हुवे ययोरिदं पप्ने विश्वं पुरा कर्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā huve yayoridaṃ papne viśvaṃ purā kṛtam |
Translation: 4 I call the Twain whose deeds of old have all been famed in ancient days

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी नमर्धतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī namardhataḥ ||
Translation: O Indra-Agni, harm us not.

Sanskit Text: उग्रा विघनिना मर्ध इन्द्राग्नी हवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughrā vighaninā mṛdha indrāghnī havāmahe |
Translation: 5 The Strong, the scatterers of the foe, Indra and Agni, we invoke;

Sanskit Text: ता नो मर्ळात ईद्र्शे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā no mṛḷāta īdṛśe ||
Translation: May they be kind to one like me.

Sanskit Text: हतो वर्त्राण्यार्या हतो दासानि सत्पती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hato vṛtrāṇyāryā hato dāsāni satpatī |
Translation: 6 They slay our Ārya foes, these Lords of heroes, slay our Dasyu foes

Sanskit Text: हतो विश्वा अप दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hato viśvā apa dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: And drive our enemies away.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी युवामिमे.अभि सतोमा अनूषत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī yuvāmime.abhi stomā anūṣata |
Translation: 7 Indra and Agni, these our songs of praise have sounded forth to you:

Sanskit Text: पिबतं शम्भुवा सुतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibataṃ śambhuvā sutam ||
Translation: Ye who bring blessings! drink the juice.

Sanskit Text: या वां सन्ति पुरुस्प्र्हो नियुतो दाशुषे नरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā vāṃ santi puruspṛho niyuto dāśuṣe narā |
Translation: 8 Come, Indra-Agni, with those teams, desired of many, which ye have,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी ताभिरा गतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī tābhirā ghatam ||
Translation: O Heroes, for the worshipper.

Sanskit Text: ताभिरा गछतं नरोपेदं सवनं सुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tābhirā ghachataṃ naropedaṃ savanaṃ sutam |
Translation: 9 With those to this libation poured, ye Heroes, Indra-Agni, come:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी सोमपीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī somapītaye ||
Translation: Come ye to drink the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: तमीळिष्व यो अर्चिषा वना विश्वा परिष्वजत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamīḷiṣva yo arciṣā vanā viśvā pariṣvajat |
Translation: 10 Glorify him who compasses all forests with his glowing flame,

Sanskit Text: कर्ष्णाक्र्णोति जिह्वया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṣṇākṛṇoti jihvayā ||
Translation: And leaves them blackened with his tongue.

Sanskit Text: य इद्ध आविवासति सुम्नमिन्द्रस्य मर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya iddha āvivāsati sumnamindrasya martyaḥ |
Translation: 11 He who gains Indra's bliss with fire enkindled finds an easy way

Sanskit Text: दयुम्नाय सुतरा अपः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyumnāya sutarā apaḥ ||
Translation: Over the floods to happiness.

Sanskit Text: ता नो वाजवतीरिष आशून पिप्र्तमर्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā no vājavatīriṣa āśūn pipṛtamarvataḥ |
Translation: 12 Give us fleet coursers to convey Indra and Agni, and bestow

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रमग्निं च वोळ्हवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indramaghniṃ ca voḷhave ||
Translation: Abundant strengthening food on us.

Sanskit Text: उभा वामिन्द्राग्नी आहुवध्या उभा राधसः सह मादयध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhā vāmindrāghnī āhuvadhyā ubhā rādhasaḥ saha mādayadhyai |
Translation: 13 Indra and Agni, I will call you hither and make you joyful with the gifts I offer.

Sanskit Text: उभा दाताराविषां रयीणामुभा वाजस्य सातये हुवे वाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhā dātārāviṣāṃ rayīṇāmubhā vājasya sātaye huve vām ||
Translation: Ye Twain are givers both of food and riches: to win me strength and vigour I invoke you.

Sanskit Text: आ नो गव्येभिरश्व्यैर्वसव्यैरुप गछतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no ghavyebhiraśvyairvasavyairupa ghachatam |
Translation: 14 Come unto us with riches, come with wealth in horses and in kine.

Sanskit Text: सखायौ देवौ सख्याय शम्भुवेन्द्राग्नी ता हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhāyau devau sakhyāya śambhuvendrāghnī tā havāmahe ||
Translation: Indra and Agni, we invoke you both, the Gods, as Friends for friendship, bringing bliss.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी शर्णुतं हवं यजमानस्य सुन्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī śṛṇutaṃ havaṃ yajamānasya sunvataḥ |
Translation: 15 Indra and Agni, hear his call who worships. with libations poured.

Sanskit Text: वीतं हव्यान्या गतं पिबतं सोम्यं मधु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vītaṃ havyānyā ghataṃ pibataṃ somyaṃ madhu ||
Translation: Come and enjoy the offerings, drink the sweetly-flavoured Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: सतुषे नरा दिवो अस्य परसन्ताश्विना हुवे जरमाणो अर्कैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stuṣe narā divo asya prasantāśvinā huve jaramāṇo arkaiḥ |
Translation: 1. I LAUD the Heroes Twain, this heaven's Controllers: singing with songs of praise I call the Aśvins,

Sanskit Text: या सद्य उस्रा वयुषि जमो अन्तान युयूषतः पर्युरूवरांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā sadya usrā vyuṣi jmo antān yuyūṣataḥ paryurūvarāṃsi ||
Translation: Fain in a moment, when the morns are breaking, to part the earth's ends and the spacious regions.

Sanskit Text: ता यज्ञमा शुचिभिश्चक्रमाणा रथस्य भानुं रुरुचूरजोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā yajñamā śucibhiścakramāṇā rathasya bhānuṃ rurucūrajobhiḥ |
Translation: 2 Moving to sacrifice through realms of lustre they light the radiance of the car that bears them.

Sanskit Text: पुरू वरांस्यमिता मिमानापो धन्वान्यति याथो अज्रान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purū varāṃsyamitā mimānāpo dhanvānyati yātho ajrān ||
Translation: Traversing many wide unmeasured spaces, over the wastes ye pass, and fields, and waters.

Sanskit Text: ता ह तयद वर्तिर्यदरध्रमुग्रेत्था धिय ऊहथुः शश्वदश्वैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā ha tyad vartiryadaradhramughretthā dhiya ūhathuḥ śaśvadaśvaiḥ |
Translation: 3 Ye to that bounteous path of yours, ye mighty, have ever borne away our thoughts with horses,

Sanskit Text: मनोजवेभिरिषिरैः शयध्यै परि वयथिर्दाशुषो मर्त्यस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manojavebhiriṣiraiḥ śayadhyai pari vyathirdāśuṣo martyasya ||
Translation: Mind-swift and full of vigour, that the trouble of man who offers gifts might cease and slumber.

Sanskit Text: ता नव्यसो जरमाणस्य मन्मोप भूषतो युयुजानसप्ती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā navyaso jaramāṇasya manmopa bhūṣato yuyujānasaptī |
Translation: 4 So ye, when ye have yoked your chariothorses, come to the hymn of the most recent singer.

Sanskit Text: शुभं पर्क्षमिषमूर्जं वहन्ता होता यक्षत परत्नो अध्रुग युवाना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śubhaṃ pṛkṣamiṣamūrjaṃ vahantā hotā yakṣat pratno adhrugh yuvānā ||
Translation: Our true and ancient Herald Priest shall bring you, the Youthful, bearing splendour, food, and vigour.

Sanskit Text: ता वल्गू दस्रा पुरुशाकतमा परत्ना नव्यसा वचसा विवासे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā valghū dasrā puruśākatamā pratnā navyasā vacasā vivāse |
Translation: 5 With newest hymn I call those Wonder-Workers, ancient and brilliant, and exceeding mighty,

Sanskit Text: या शंसते सतुवते शम्भविष्ठा बभूवतुर्ग्र्णते चित्रराती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā śaṃsate stuvate śambhaviṣṭhā babhūvaturghṛṇate citrarātī ||
Translation: Bringers of bliss to him who lauds and praises, bestowing varied bounties on the singer.

Sanskit Text: ता भुज्युं विभिरद्भ्यः समुद्रात तुग्रस्य सूनुमूहथूरजोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā bhujyuṃ vibhiradbhyaḥ samudrāt tughrasya sūnumūhathūrajobhiḥ |
Translation: 6 So ye, with birds, out of the sea and waters bore Bhujyu, son of Tugra, through the regions.

Sanskit Text: अरेणुभिर्योजनेभिर्भुजन्ता पतत्रिभिरर्णसोनिरुपस्थात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: areṇubhiryojanebhirbhujantā patatribhirarṇasonirupasthāt ||
Translation: Speeding with winged steeds through dustless spaces, out of the bosom of the flood they bore him.

Sanskit Text: वि जयुषा रथ्या यातमद्रिं शरुतं हवं वर्षणा वध्रिमत्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi jayuṣā rathyā yātamadriṃ śrutaṃ havaṃ vṛṣaṇā vadhrimatyāḥ |
Translation: 7 Victors, car-borne, ye rent the rock asunder: Bulls, heard the calling of the eunuch's consort.

Sanskit Text: दशस्यन्ता शयवे पिप्यथुर्गामिति चयवाना सुमतिं भुरण्यू ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśasyantā śayave pipyathurghāmiti cyavānā sumatiṃ bhuraṇyū ||
Translation: Bounteous, ye filled the cow with milk for Śayu: thus, swift and zealous Ones, ye showed your favour.

Sanskit Text: यद रोदसी परदिवो अस्ति भूमा हेळो देवानामुत मर्त्यत्रा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad rodasī pradivo asti bhūmā heḷo devānāmuta martyatrā |
Translation: 8 Whate’er from olden time, Heaven, Earth! existeth great object of the wrath of Gods and mortals,

Sanskit Text: तदादित्या वसवो रुद्रियासो रक्षोयुजे तपुरघं दधात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadādityā vasavo rudriyāso rakṣoyuje tapuraghaṃ dadhāta ||
Translation: Make that, Ādityas, Vasus, sons of Rudra, an evil brand to one allied with demons.

Sanskit Text: य ईं राजानाव रतुथा विदधद रजसो मित्रो वरुणश्चिकेतत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya īṃ rājānāv ṛtuthā vidadhad rajaso mitro varuṇaściketat |
Translation: 9 May he who knows, as Varuṇa and Mitra, air's realm, appointing both the Kings in season,

Sanskit Text: गम्भीराय रक्षसे हेतिमस्य दरोघाय चिद वचस आनवाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghambhīrāya rakṣase hetimasya droghāya cid vacasa ānavāya ||
Translation: Against the secret fiend cast forth his weapon, against the lying words that strangers utter.

Sanskit Text: अन्तरैश्चक्रैस्तनयाय वर्तिर्द्युमता यातं नर्वता रथेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: antaraiścakraistanayāya vartirdyumatā yātaṃ nṛvatā rathena |
Translation: 10 Come to our home with friendly wheels, for offipring; come on your radiant chariot rich in heroes.

Sanskit Text: सनुत्येन तयजसा मर्त्यस्य वनुष्यतामपि शीर्षावव्र्क्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanutyena tyajasā martyasya vanuṣyatāmapi śīrṣāvavṛktam ||
Translation: Strike off, ye Twain, the heads of our assailants who with man's treacherous attack approach us.

Sanskit Text: आ परमाभिरुत मध्यमाभिर्नियुद्भिर्यातमवमाभिरर्वाक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā paramābhiruta madhyamābhirniyudbhiryātamavamābhirarvāk |
Translation: 11 Come hitherward to us with teams of horses, the highest and the midmost and the lowest.

Sanskit Text: दर्ळ्हस्य चिद गोमतो वि वरजस्य दुरो वर्तं गर्णते चित्रराती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dṛḷhasya cid ghomato vi vrajasya duro vartaṃ ghṛṇate citrarātī ||
Translation: Bountiful Lords, throw open to the singer doors e’en of the firm-closed stall of cattle.

Sanskit Text: कव तया वल्गू पुरुहूताद्य दूतो न सतोमो.अविदन नमस्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kva tyā valghū puruhūtādya dūto na stomo.avidan namasvān |
Translation: 1. WHERE hath the hymn with reverence, like an envoy, found both fair Gods to-day, invoked of many-

Sanskit Text: आ यो अर्वां नासत्या ववर्त परेष्ठा हयसथो अस्य मन्मन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yo arvāṃ nāsatyā vavarta preṣṭhā hyasatho asya manman ||
Translation: Hymn that hath brought the two Nāsatyas hither? To this man's thought be ye, both Gods, most friendly.

Sanskit Text: अरं मे गन्तं हवनायास्मै गर्णाना यथा पिबाथो अन्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: araṃ me ghantaṃ havanāyāsmai ghṛṇānā yathā pibātho andhaḥ |
Translation: 2 Come readily to this mine invocation, lauded with songs, that ye may drink the juices.

Sanskit Text: परि ह तयद वर्तिर्याथो रिषो न यत परो नान्तरस्तुतुर्यात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari ha tyad vartiryātho riṣo na yat paro nāntarastuturyāt ||
Translation: Compass this house to keep it from the foeman, that none may force it, either near or distant.

Sanskit Text: अकारि वामन्धसो वरीमन्नस्तारि बर्हिः सुप्रायणतमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: akāri vāmandhaso varīmannastāri barhiḥ suprāyaṇatamam |
Translation: 3 Juice in wide room hath been prepared to feast you: for you the grass is strewn, most soft to tread on.

Sanskit Text: उत्तानहस्तो युवयुर्ववन्दा वां नक्षन्तो अद्रय आञ्जन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uttānahasto yuvayurvavandā vāṃ nakṣanto adraya āñjan ||
Translation: With lifted hands your servant hath adored you. Yearningfor you the press-stones shed the liquid.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वो वामग्निरध्वरेष्वस्थात पर रातिरेति जूर्णिनीघ्र्ताची |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvo vāmaghniradhvareṣvasthāt pra rātireti jūrṇinīghṛtācī |
Translation: 4 Agni uplifts him at your sacrifices: forth goes the oblation dropping oil and glowing.

Sanskit Text: पर होता गूर्तमना उराणो.अयुक्त यो नासत्या हवीमन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra hotā ghūrtamanā urāṇo.ayukta yo nāsatyā havīman ||
Translation: Up stands the grateful-minded priest, elected, appointed to invoke the two Nāsatyas.

Sanskit Text: अधि शरिये दुहिता सूर्यस्य रथं तस्थौ पुरुभुजा शतोतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi śriye duhitā sūryasya rathaṃ tasthau purubhujā śatotim |
Translation: 5 Lords of great wealth! for glory, Sūrya's Daughter mounted your car that brings a hundred succours.

Sanskit Text: पर मायाभिर्मायिना भूतमत्र नरा नर्तू जनिमन यज्ञियानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra māyābhirmāyinā bhūtamatra narā nṛtū janiman yajñiyānām ||
Translation: Famed for your magic arts were ye, magicians! amid the race of Gods, ye dancing Heroes!

Sanskit Text: युवं शरीभिर्दर्शताभिराभिः शुभे पुष्टिमूहथुःसूर्यायाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ śrībhirdarśatābhirābhiḥ śubhe puṣṭimūhathuḥsūryāyāḥ |
Translation: 6 Ye Twain, with these your glories fair to look on, brought, to win victory, rich gifts for Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: पर वां वयो वपुषे.अनु पप्तन नक्षद वाणी सुष्टुता धिष्ण्या वाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vāṃ vayo vapuṣe.anu paptan nakṣad vāṇī suṣṭutā dhiṣṇyā vām ||
Translation: After you flew your birds, marvels of beauty: dear to our hearts! the song, well lauded, reached you.

Sanskit Text: आ वां वयो.अश्वासो वहिष्ठा अभि परयो नासत्या वहन्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ vayo.aśvāso vahiṣṭhā abhi prayo nāsatyā vahantu |
Translation: 7 May your winged coursers, best to draw. Nāsatyas! convey you to the object of your wishes.

Sanskit Text: पर वां रथो मनोजवा असर्जीषः पर्क्ष इषिधो अनु पूर्वीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vāṃ ratho manojavā asarjīṣaḥ pṛkṣa iṣidho anu pūrvīḥ ||
Translation: Swift as the thought, your car hath been sent onward to food of many a sort and dainty viands.

Sanskit Text: पुरु हि वां पुरुभुजा देष्णं धेनुं न इषं पिन्वतमसक्राम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: puru hi vāṃ purubhujā deṣṇaṃ dhenuṃ na iṣaṃ pinvatamasakrām |
Translation: 8 Lords of great wealth, manifold is your bounty: ye filled our cow with food that never faileth.

Sanskit Text: सतुतश्च वां माध्वी सुष्टुतिश्च रसाश्च ये वामनु रातिमग्मन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stutaśca vāṃ mādhvī suṣṭutiśca rasāśca ye vāmanu rātimaghman ||
Translation: Lovers of sweetness! yours are praise and singers, and poured libations which have sought your favour.

Sanskit Text: उत म रज्रे पुरयस्य रघ्वी सुमीळ्हे शतं पेरुके च पक्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta ma ṛjre purayasya raghvī sumīḷhe śataṃ peruke ca pakvā |
Translation: 9 Mine were two mares of Puraya, brown, swift-footed; a hundred with Sumidha, food with Peruk

Sanskit Text: शाण्डो दाद धिरणिनः समद्दिष्टीन दश वशासो अभिषाच रष्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śāṇḍo dād dhiraṇinaḥ smaddiṣṭīn daśa vaśāso abhiṣāca ṛṣvān ||
Translation: Sanda gave ten gold-decked and well-trained horses, tame and obedient and of lofty stature.

Sanskit Text: सं वां शता नासत्या सहस्राश्वानां पुरुपन्था गिरे दात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ vāṃ śatā nāsatyā sahasrāśvānāṃ purupanthā ghire dāt |
Translation: 10 Nāsatyas! Purupanthas offered hundreds, thousands of steeds to him who sang your praises,

Sanskit Text: भरद्वाजाय वीर नू गिरे दाद धता रक्षांसि पुरुदंससा सयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharadvājāya vīra nū ghire dād dhatā rakṣāṃsi purudaṃsasā syuḥ ||
Translation: Gave, Heroes! to the singer Bharadvāja. Ye-Wonder-Workers, let the fiends be slaughtered.

Sanskit Text: आ वां सुम्ने वरिमन सूरिभिः षयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ sumne variman sūribhiḥ ṣyām ||
Translation: 11 May I with princes share your bliss in freedom.

Sanskit Text: एषा सया नो दुहिता दिवोजाः कषितीरुछन्ती मानुषीरजीगः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣā syā no duhitā divojāḥ kṣitīruchantī mānuṣīrajīghaḥ |
Translation: 1. SHEDDING her light on human habitations this Child of Heaven hath called us from our slumber;

Sanskit Text: या भानुना रुशता राम्यास्वज्ञायि तिरस्तमसश्चिदक्तून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā bhānunā ruśatā rāmyāsvajñāyi tirastamasaścidaktūn ||
Translation: She who at night-time with her argent lustre hath shown herself e’en through the shades of darkness.

Sanskit Text: वि तद ययुररुणयुग्भिरश्वैश्चित्रं भान्त्युषसश्चन्द्ररथाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi tad yayuraruṇayughbhiraśvaiścitraṃ bhāntyuṣasaścandrarathāḥ |
Translation: 2 All this with red-rayed steeds have they divided: the Dawns on bright cars shine in wondrous fashion.

Sanskit Text: अग्रं यज्ञस्य बर्हतो नयन्तीर्वि ता बाधन्तेतम ऊर्म्यायाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghraṃ yajñasya bṛhato nayantīrvi tā bādhantetama ūrmyāyāḥ ||
Translation: They, bringing near the stately rite's commencement, drive far away the night's surrounding shadows.

Sanskit Text: शरवो वाजमिषमूर्जं वहन्तीर्नि दाशुष उषसो मर्त्याय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śravo vājamiṣamūrjaṃ vahantīrni dāśuṣa uṣaso martyāya |
Translation: 3 Dawns, bringing hither, to the man who worships, glory and power and might and food and vigour,

Sanskit Text: मघोनीर्वीरवत पत्यमाना अवो धात विधते रत्नमद्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maghonīrvīravat patyamānā avo dhāta vidhate ratnamadya ||
Translation: Opulent, with imperial sway like heroes, favour your servant and this day enrich him.

Sanskit Text: इदा हि वो विधते रत्नमस्तीदा वीराय दाशुष उषासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idā hi vo vidhate ratnamastīdā vīrāya dāśuṣa uṣāsaḥ |
Translation: 4 Now is there treasure for the man who serves you, now for the hero, Dawns! who brings oblation;

Sanskit Text: इदा विप्राय जरते यदुक्था नि षम मावते वहथ पुर चित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: idā viprāya jarate yadukthā ni ṣma māvate vahatha pura cit ||
Translation: Now for the singer when he sings the praise-song. Even to one like me ye brought aforetime.

Sanskit Text: इदा हि त उषो अद्रिसानो गोत्रा गवामन्गिरसो गर्णन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idā hi ta uṣo adrisāno ghotrā ghavāmanghiraso ghṛṇanti |
Translation: 5 O Dawn who standest on the mountain ridges, Aṅgirases now praise thy stalls of cattle.

Sanskit Text: वयर्केण बिभिदुर्ब्रह्मणा च सत्या नर्णामभवद देवहूतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyarkeṇa bibhidurbrahmaṇā ca satyā nṛṇāmabhavad devahūtiḥ ||
Translation: With prayer and holy hymn they burst them open: the heroes' calling on the Gods was fruitful.

Sanskit Text: उछा दिवो दुहितः परत्नवन नो भरद्वाजवद विधते मघोनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uchā divo duhitaḥ pratnavan no bharadvājavad vidhate maghoni |
Translation: 6 Shine on us as of old, thou Child of Heaven,on him, rich Maid! who serves like Bharadvāja.

Sanskit Text: सुवीरं रयिं गर्णते रिरीह्युरुगायमधि धेहि शरवो नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvīraṃ rayiṃ ghṛṇate rirīhyurughāyamadhi dhehi śravo naḥ ||
Translation: Give to the singer wealth with noble heroes, and upon us bestow wide-spreading glory.

Sanskit Text: वपुर्नु तच्चिकितुषे चिदस्तु समानं नाम धेनु पत्यमानम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vapurnu taccikituṣe cidastu samānaṃ nāma dhenu patyamānam |
Translation: 1. E'EN to the wise let that be still a wonder to which the general name of Cow is given.

Sanskit Text: मर्तेष्वन्यद दोहसे पीपाय सक्र्च्छुक्रं दुदुहे पर्श्निरूधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: marteṣvanyad dohase pīpāya sakṛcchukraṃ duduhe pṛśnirūdhaḥ ||
Translation: The one hath swelled among mankind for milking: Pṛśni hath drained but once her fair bright udder.

Sanskit Text: ये अग्नयो न शोशुचन्निधाना दविर्यत तरिर्मरुतो वाव्र्धन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye aghnayo na śośucannidhānā dviryat trirmaruto vāvṛdhanta |
Translation: 2 They who like kindled flames of fire are glowing,. the Maruts, twice and thrice have waxen mighty.

Sanskit Text: अरेञवो हिरण्ययास एषां साकं नर्म्णैः पौंस्येभिश्च भूवन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: areñavo hiraṇyayāsa eṣāṃ sākaṃ nṛmṇaiḥ pauṃsyebhiśca bhūvan ||
Translation: Golden and dustless were their cars, invested with their great strength and their heroic vigour.

Sanskit Text: रुद्रस्य ये मीळ्हुषः सन्ति पुत्रा यांश्चो नु दाध्र्विर्भरध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rudrasya ye mīḷhuṣaḥ santi putrā yāṃśco nu dādhṛvirbharadhyai |
Translation: 3 They who are Sons of the rain-pouring Rudra, whom the long-lasting One had power to foster:

Sanskit Text: विदे हि माता महो मही षा सेत पर्श्निः सुभ्वे गर्भमाधात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vide hi mātā maho mahī ṣā set pṛśniḥ subhve gharbhamādhāt ||
Translation: The Mighty Ones whose germ great Mother Pṛśni is known to have received for man's advantage.

Sanskit Text: न य इषन्ते जनुषो.अया नवन्तः सन्तो.अवद्यानि पुनानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na ya iṣante januṣo.ayā nvantaḥ santo.avadyāni punānāḥ |
Translation: 4 They shrink not from the birth; in this same manner still resting there they purge away reproaches.

Sanskit Text: निर्यद दुह्रे शुचयो.अनु जोषमनु शरिया तन्वमुक्षमाणाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niryad duhre śucayo.anu joṣamanu śriyā tanvamukṣamāṇāḥ ||
Translation: When they have streamed forth, brilliant, at their pleasure, with their own splendour they bedew their bodies.

Sanskit Text: मक्षू न येषु दोहसे चिदया आ नाम धर्ष्णु मारुतन्दधानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: makṣū na yeṣu dohase cidayā ā nāma dhṛṣṇu mārutandadhānāḥ |
Translation: 5 Even those who bear the brave bold name of Maruts, whom not the active quickly wins for milking.

Sanskit Text: न ये सतौना अयासो मह्ना नू चित सुदानुरव वासदुग्रान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na ye staunā ayāso mahnā nū cit sudānurava vāsadughrān ||
Translation: Even the liberal wards not off those fierce ones, those who are light and agile in their greatness.

Sanskit Text: त इदुग्राः शवसा धर्ष्णुषेणा उभे युजन्त रोदसी सुमेके |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta idughrāḥ śavasā dhṛṣṇuṣeṇā ubhe yujanta rodasī sumeke |
Translation: 6 When, strong in strength and armed with potent weapons, they had united wellformed earth and heaven,

Sanskit Text: अध समैषु रोदसी सवशोचिरामवत्सु तस्थौ न रोकः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha smaiṣu rodasī svaśocirāmavatsu tasthau na rokaḥ ||
Translation: Rodasl stood among these furious Heroes like splendour shining with her native brightness.

Sanskit Text: अनेनो वो मरुतो यामो अस्त्वनश्वश्चिद यमजत्यरथीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aneno vo maruto yāmo astvanaśvaścid yamajatyarathīḥ |
Translation: 7 No team of goats shall draw your car, O Maruts, no horse no charioteer be he who drives it.

Sanskit Text: अनवसो अनभीशू रजस्तूर्वि रोदसी पथ्या याति साधन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anavaso anabhīśū rajastūrvi rodasī pathyā yāti sādhan ||
Translation: Halting not, reinless, through the air it travels, speeding alone its paths through earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: नास्य वर्ता न तरुता नवस्ति मरुतो यमवथ वजसातौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāsya vartā na tarutā nvasti maruto yamavatha vajasātau |
Translation: 8 None may obstruct, none overtake, O Maruts, him whom ye succour in the strife of battle

Sanskit Text: तोके वा गोषु तनये यमप्सु स वरजं दर्ता पार्ये अध दयोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: toke vā ghoṣu tanaye yamapsu sa vrajaṃ dartā pārye adha dyoḥ ||
Translation: For sons and progeny, for kine and waters: he bursts the cow-stall on the day of trial.

Sanskit Text: पर चित्रमर्कं गर्णते तुराय मारुताय सवतवसे भरध्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra citramarkaṃ ghṛṇate turāya mārutāya svatavase bharadhvam |
Translation: 9 Bring a bright hymn to praise the band of Maruts, the Singers, rapid, strong in native vigour,

Sanskit Text: ये सहांसि सहसा सहन्ते रेजते अग्ने पर्थिवी मखेभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye sahāṃsi sahasā sahante rejate aghne pṛthivī makhebhyaḥ ||
Translation: Who conquer mighty strength with strength more mighty: earth shakes in terror at their wars, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: तविषीमन्तो अध्वरस्येव दिद्युत तर्षुच्यवसो जुह्वो नाग्नेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tviṣīmanto adhvarasyeva didyut tṛṣucyavaso juhvo nāghneḥ |
Translation: 10 Bright like the flashing flames of sacrifices, like tongues of fire impetuous in their onset,

Sanskit Text: अर्चत्रयो धुनयो न वीरा भराजज्जन्मानो मरुतो अध्र्ष्टाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arcatrayo dhunayo na vīrā bhrājajjanmāno maruto adhṛṣṭāḥ ||
Translation: Chanting their psalm, singing aloud, like heroes, splendid from birth, invincible, the Maruts.

Sanskit Text: तं वर्धन्तं मारुतं भराजद्र्ष्टिं रुद्रस्य सूनुं हवसा विवासे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vṛdhantaṃ mārutaṃ bhrājadṛṣṭiṃ rudrasya sūnuṃ havasā vivāse |
Translation: 11 That swelling band I call with invocation, the brood of Rudra, armed with glittering lances.

Sanskit Text: दिवः शर्धाय शुचयो मनीषा गिरयो नाप उग्रा अस्प्र्ध्रन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divaḥ śardhāya śucayo manīṣā ghirayo nāpa ughrā aspṛdhran ||
Translation: Pure hymns are meet for that celestial army: like floods and mountains have the Strong Ones battled.

Sanskit Text: विश्वेषां वः सतां जयेष्ठतमा गीर्भिर्मित्रावरुणावाव्र्धध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśveṣāṃ vaḥ satāṃ jyeṣṭhatamā ghīrbhirmitrāvaruṇāvāvṛdhadhyai |
Translation: 1. NOW Mitra-Varuṇa shall be exalted high by your songs, noblest of all existing;

Sanskit Text: सं या रश्मेव यमतुर्यमिष्ठा दवा जनानसमा बाहुभिः सवैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yā raśmeva yamaturyamiṣṭhā dvā janānasamā bāhubhiḥ svaiḥ ||
Translation: They who, as ’twere with reins are best Controllers, unequalled with their arms to check the people.

Sanskit Text: इयं मद वां पर सत्र्णीते मनीषोप परिया नमसा बर्हिरछ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyaṃ mad vāṃ pra stṛṇīte manīṣopa priyā namasā barhiracha |
Translation: 2 To you Two Gods is this my thought extended, turned to the sacred grass with loving homage.

Sanskit Text: यन्तं नो मित्रावरुणावध्र्ष्टं छर्दिर्यद वां वरूथ्यं सुदानू ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yantaṃ no mitrāvaruṇāvadhṛṣṭaṃ chardiryad vāṃ varūthyaṃ sudānū ||
Translation: Give us, O Mitra-Varuṇa, a dwelling safe from attack, which ye shall guard, Boon-Givers!

Sanskit Text: आ यातं मित्रावरुणा सुशस्त्युप परिया नमसा हूयमाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yātaṃ mitrāvaruṇā suśastyupa priyā namasā hūyamānā |
Translation: 3 Come hither, Mitra-Varuṇa, invited with eulogies and loving adoration,

Sanskit Text: सं यावप्नः सथो अपसेव जनाञ्छ्रुधीयतश्चिद यतथो महित्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yāvapnaḥ stho apaseva janāñchrudhīyataścid yatatho mahitvā ||
Translation: Ye who with your might, as Work-Controllers, urge even men who quickly hear to labour.

Sanskit Text: अश्वा न या वाजिना पूतबन्धू रता यद गर्भमदितिर्भरध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvā na yā vājinā pūtabandhū ṛtā yad gharbhamaditirbharadhyai |
Translation: 4 Whom, of pure origin, like two strong horses, Aditi bore as babes in proper season,

Sanskit Text: पर या महि महान्ता जायमाना घोरा मर्तायरिपवे नि दीधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yā mahi mahāntā jāyamānā ghorā martāyaripave ni dīdhaḥ ||
Translation: Whom, Mighty at your birth, the Mighty Goddess brought forth as terrors to the mortal foeman.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे यद वां मंहना मन्दमानाः कषत्रं देवासो अदधुः सजोषाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve yad vāṃ maṃhanā mandamānāḥ kṣatraṃ devāso adadhuḥ sajoṣāḥ |
Translation: 5 As all the Gods in their great joy and gladness gave you with one accord your high dominion,

Sanskit Text: परि यद भूथो रोदसी चिदुर्वी सन्ति सपशो अदब्धासो अमूराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari yad bhūtho rodasī cidurvī santi spaśo adabdhāso amūrāḥ ||
Translation: As ye surround both worlds, though wide and spacious your spies are ever true and never bewildered.

Sanskit Text: ता हि कषत्रं धारयेथे अनु दयून दरंहेथे सानुमुपमादिव दयोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā hi kṣatraṃ dhārayethe anu dyūn dṛṃhethe sānumupamādiva dyoḥ |
Translation: 6 So, through the days maintaining princely power. ye prop the height as ’twere from loftiest heaven.

Sanskit Text: दर्ळ्हो नक्षत्र उत विश्वदेवो भूमिमातान दयां धासिनायोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dṛḷho nakṣatra uta viśvadevo bhūmimātān dyāṃ dhāsināyoḥ ||
Translation: The Star of all the Gods, established, filleth the heaven and earth with food of man who liveth.

Sanskit Text: ता विग्रं धैथे जठरं पर्णध्या आ यत सद्म सभ्र्तयः पर्णन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā vighraṃ dhaithe jaṭharaṃ pṛṇadhyā ā yat sadma sabhṛtayaḥ pṛṇanti |
Translation: 7 Take the strong drink, to quaff till ye are sated, when he and his attendants fill the chamber.

Sanskit Text: न मर्ष्यन्ते युवतयो.अवाता वि यत पयो विश्वजिन्वा भरन्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na mṛṣyante yuvatayo.avātā vi yat payo viśvajinvā bharante ||
Translation: The young Maids brook not that none seeks to win them, when, Quickeners of all! they scatter moisture.

Sanskit Text: ता जिह्वया सदमेदं सुमेधा आ यद वां सत्यो अरतिरते भूत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā jihvayā sadamedaṃ sumedhā ā yad vāṃ satyo aratirte bhūt |
Translation: 8 So with your tongue come ever, when your envoy, faithful and very wise, attends our worship.

Sanskit Text: तद वां महित्वं घर्तान्नावस्तु युवं दाशुषेवि चयिष्टमंहः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad vāṃ mahitvaṃ ghṛtānnāvastu yuvaṃ dāśuṣevi cayiṣṭamaṃhaḥ ||
Translation: Nourished by holy oil! he this yGur glory: annihilate the sacrificer's trouble.

Sanskit Text: पर यद वां मित्रावरुणा सपूर्धन परिया धाम युवधिता मिनन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yad vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā spūrdhan priyā dhāma yuvadhitā minanti |
Translation: 9 When, Mitra-Varuṇa, they strive against you and break tlie friendly laws ye have established,

Sanskit Text: न ये देवास ओहसा न मर्ता अयज्ञसाचो अप्यो नपुत्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na ye devāsa ohasā na martā ayajñasāco apyo naputrāḥ ||
Translation: They, neither Gods nor men in estimation, like Api's sons have godless sacrifices.

Sanskit Text: वि यद वाचं कीस्तासो भरन्ते शंसन्ति के चिन निविदो मनानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yad vācaṃ kīstāso bharante śaṃsanti ke cin nivido manānāḥ |
Translation: 10 When singers in their song uplift their voices, some chant the Nivid texts with steady purpose.

Sanskit Text: आद वां बरवाम सत्यान्युक्था नकिर्देवेभिर्यतथो महित्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ād vāṃ bravāma satyānyukthā nakirdevebhiryatatho mahitvā ||
Translation: Then may we sing you lauds that shall be fruitful: dp ye not rival all the Gods in greatness?

Sanskit Text: अवोरित्था वां छर्दिषो अभिष्टौ युवोर्मित्रावरुणावस्क्र्धोयु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avoritthā vāṃ chardiṣo abhiṣṭau yuvormitrāvaruṇāvaskṛdhoyu |
Translation: 11 O Mitra-Varuṇa, may your large bounty come to us hither, near to this our dwelling,

Sanskit Text: अनु यद गाव सफुरान रजिप्यं धर्ष्णुं यद रणेव्र्षणं युनजन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu yad ghāva sphurān ṛjipyaṃ dhṛṣṇuṃ yad raṇevṛṣaṇaṃ yunajan ||
Translation: When the kine haste to us, and when they harness the fleet-foot mettled stallion for the battle.

Sanskit Text: शरुष्टी वां यज्ञ उद्यतः सजोषा मनुष्वद वर्क्तबर्हिषो यजध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śruṣṭī vāṃ yajña udyataḥ sajoṣā manuṣvad vṛktabarhiṣo yajadhyai |
Translation: 1. HIS honouring rite whose grass is trimmed is offered swiftly to you, in Manu's wise, accordant,

Sanskit Text: आ य इन्द्रावरुणाविषे अद्य महे सुम्नाय मह आववर्तत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ya indrāvaruṇāviṣe adya mahe sumnāya maha āvavartat ||
Translation: The rite which Indra-Varuṇa shall carry this day to high success and glorious issue.

Sanskit Text: ता हि शरेष्ठा देवताता तुजा शूराणां शविष्ठाता हि भूतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā hi śreṣṭhā devatātā tujā śūrāṇāṃ śaviṣṭhātā hi bhūtam |
Translation: 2 For at Gods’ worship they are best through vigour; they have become the strongest of the Heroes;

Sanskit Text: मघोनां मंहिष्ठा तुविशुष्म रतेन वर्त्रतुरा सर्वसेना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maghonāṃ maṃhiṣṭhā tuviśuṣma ṛtena vṛtraturā sarvasenā ||
Translation: With mighty strength, most liberal of the Princes, Chiefs of the host, by Law made Vṛtra's slayers.

Sanskit Text: ता गर्णीहि नमस्येभिः शूषैः सुम्नेभिरिन्द्रावरुणा चकाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā ghṛṇīhi namasyebhiḥ śūṣaiḥ sumnebhirindrāvaruṇā cakānā |
Translation: 3 Praise those Twain Gods for powers that merit worship, Indra and Varuṇa, for bliss, the joyous.

Sanskit Text: वज्रेणान्यः शवसा हन्ति वर्त्रं सिषक्त्यन्यो वर्जनेषु विप्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vajreṇānyaḥ śavasā hanti vṛtraṃ siṣaktyanyo vṛjaneṣu vipraḥ ||
Translation: One with his might and thunderbolt slays Vṛtra; the other as a Sage stands near in troubles.

Sanskit Text: गनाश्च यन नरश्च वाव्र्धन्त विश्वे देवासो नरां सवगूर्ताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghnāśca yan naraśca vāvṛdhanta viśve devāso narāṃ svaghūrtāḥ |
Translation: 4 Though dames and men have waxen strong and mighty, and all the Gods selfpraised among the Heroes,

Sanskit Text: परैभ्य इन्द्रावरुणा महित्वा दयौश्च पर्थिवि भूतमुर्वी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: praibhya indrāvaruṇā mahitvā dyauśca pṛthivi bhūtamurvī ||
Translation: Ye, Indra-Varuṇa, have in might surpassed them, and thus were ye spread wide, O Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: स इत सुदानुः सववान रतावेन्द्रा यो वां वरुण दाशतित्मन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa it sudānuḥ svavān ṛtāvendrā yo vāṃ varuṇa dāśatitman |
Translation: 5 Righteous is he, and liberal and helpful who, Indra-Varuṇa, brings you gifts with gladness.

Sanskit Text: इषा स दविषस्तरेद दास्वान वंसद रयिं रयिवतश्च जनान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣā sa dviṣastared dāsvān vaṃsad rayiṃ rayivataśca janān ||
Translation: That bounteous man through food shall conquer faemen, and win him opulence and wealthy people.

Sanskit Text: यं युवं दाश्वध्वराय देवा रयिं धत्थो वसुमन्तं पुरुक्षुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ yuvaṃ dāśvadhvarāya devā rayiṃ dhattho vasumantaṃ purukṣum |
Translation: 6 May wealth which ye bestow in food and treasure on him who brings you gifts and sacrifices,

Sanskit Text: अस्मे स इन्द्रावरुणावपि षयात पर यो भनक्ति वनुषामशस्तीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme sa indrāvaruṇāvapi ṣyāt pra yo bhanakti vanuṣāmaśastīḥ ||
Translation: Wealth, Gods! which breaks the curse of those who vex us, be, Indra-Varuṇa, e’en our own possession.

Sanskit Text: उत नः सुत्रात्रो देवगोपाः सूरिभ्य इन्द्रावरुणा रयिः षयात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta naḥ sutrātro devaghopāḥ sūribhya indrāvaruṇā rayiḥ ṣyāt |
Translation: 7 So also, Indra-Varuṇa, may our princes have riches swift to save, with Gods to guard them-

Sanskit Text: येषां शुष्मः पर्तनासु साह्वान पर सद्यो दयुम्नातिरते ततुरिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yeṣāṃ śuṣmaḥ pṛtanāsu sāhvān pra sadyo dyumnātirate taturiḥ ||
Translation: They whose great might gives victory in battles, and their triumphant glory spreads with swiftness.

Sanskit Text: नू न इन्द्रावरुणा गर्णाना पर्ङकतं रयिं सौश्रवसाय देवा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū na indrāvaruṇā ghṛṇānā pṛṅktaṃ rayiṃ sauśravasāya devā |
Translation: 8 Indra. and Varuṇa, Gods whom we are lauding, mingle ye wealth with our heroic glory.

Sanskit Text: इत्था गर्णन्तो महिनस्य शर्धो.अपो न नावा दुरितातरेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: itthā ghṛṇanto mahinasya śardho.apo na nāvā duritātarema ||
Translation: May we, who praise the strength of what is mighty, pass dangers, as with boats we cross the waters.

Sanskit Text: पर सम्राजे बर्हते मन्म नु परियमर्च देवाय वरुणाय सप्रथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra samrāje bṛhate manma nu priyamarca devāya varuṇāya saprathaḥ |
Translation: 9 Now will I sing a dear and far-extending hymn to Varuṇa the God, sublime, imperial Lord,

Sanskit Text: अयं य उर्वी महिना महिव्रतः करत्वा विभात्यजरो न शोचिषा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ ya urvī mahinā mahivrataḥ kratvā vibhātyajaro na śociṣā ||
Translation: Who, mighty Governor, Eternal, as with flame, illumines both wide worlds with majesty and power.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रावरुणा सुतपाविमं सुतं सोमं पिबतं मद्यं धर्तव्रता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāvaruṇā sutapāvimaṃ sutaṃ somaṃ pibataṃ madyaṃ dhṛtavratā |
Translation: 10 True to Law, Indra-Varuṇa, drinkers of the juice, drink this pressed Soma which shall give you rapturous joy.

Sanskit Text: युवो रथो अध्वरं देववीतये परति सवसरमुप याति पीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvo ratho adhvaraṃ devavītaye prati svasaramupa yāti pītaye ||
Translation: Your chariot cometh to the banquet of the Gods, to sacrifice, as it were home, that ye may drink.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रावरुणा मधुमत्तमस्य वर्ष्णः सोमस्य वर्षणा वर्षेथाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāvaruṇā madhumattamasya vṛṣṇaḥ somasya vṛṣaṇā vṛṣethām |
Translation: 11 Indra and Varuṇa, drink your fill, ye Heroes, of this invigorating sweetest Soma.

Sanskit Text: इदं वामन्धः परिषिक्तमस्मे आसद्यास्मिन बर्हिषि मादयेथाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ vāmandhaḥ pariṣiktamasme āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayethām ||
Translation: This juice is shed by us that ye may quaff it: on this trimmed grass be seated, and rejoice you

Sanskit Text: सं वां कर्मणा समिषा हिनोमीन्द्राविष्णू अपसस परेस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ vāṃ karmaṇā samiṣā hinomīndrāviṣṇū apasas pareasya |
Translation: 1. INDRA and Viṣṇu, at my task's completion I urge you on with food and sacred service.

Sanskit Text: जुषेथां यज्ञं दरविणं च धत्तमरिष्टैर्नः पथिभिः पारयन्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣethāṃ yajñaṃ draviṇaṃ ca dhattamariṣṭairnaḥ pathibhiḥ pārayantā ||
Translation: Accept the sacrifice and grant us riches, leading us on by unobstructed pathways.

Sanskit Text: या विश्वासां जनितरा मतीनामिन्द्राविष्णू कलशा सोमधाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā viśvāsāṃ janitarā matīnāmindrāviṣṇū kalaśā somadhānā |
Translation: 2 Ye who inspire all hymns, Indra and Viṣṇu, ye vessels who contain the Soma juices,

Sanskit Text: पर वां गिरः शस्यमाना अवन्तु पर सतोमासो गीयमानासो अर्कैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vāṃ ghiraḥ śasyamānā avantu pra stomāso ghīyamānāso arkaiḥ ||
Translation: May hymns of praise that now are sung address you, the lauds that are recited by the singers.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राविष्णू मदपती मदानामा सोमं यातं दरविणो दधाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāviṣṇū madapatī madānāmā somaṃ yātaṃ draviṇo dadhānā |
Translation: 3 Lords of joy-giving draughts, Indra and Viṣṇu, come, giving gifts of treasure, to the Soma.

Sanskit Text: सं वामञ्जन्त्वक्तुभिर्मतीनां सं सतोमासः शस्यमानास उक्थैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ vāmañjantvaktubhirmatīnāṃ saṃ stomāsaḥ śasyamānāsa ukthaiḥ ||
Translation: With brilliant rays of hymns let chanted praises, repeated with the lauds, adorn and deck you.

Sanskit Text: आ वामश्वासो अभिमातिषाह इन्द्राविष्णू सधमादो वहन्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāmaśvāso abhimātiṣāha indrāviṣṇū sadhamādo vahantu |
Translation: 4 May your foe-conquering horses bring you hither, Indra and Viṣṇu, sharers of the banquet.

Sanskit Text: जुषेथां विश्वा हवना मतीनामुप बरह्माणि शर्णुतं गिरो मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣethāṃ viśvā havanā matīnāmupa brahmāṇi śṛṇutaṃ ghiro me ||
Translation: Of all our hymns accept the invocations list to my prayers and hear the songs I sing you.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राविष्णू तत पनयाय्यं वां सोमस्य मद उरु चक्रमाथे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāviṣṇū tat panayāyyaṃ vāṃ somasya mada uru cakramāthe |
Translation: 5 This your deed, Indra-Viṣṇu, must be lauded: widely ye strode in the wild joy of Soma.

Sanskit Text: अक्र्णुतमन्तरिक्षं वरीयो.अप्रथतं जीवसे नो रजांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: akṛṇutamantarikṣaṃ varīyo.aprathataṃ jīvase no rajāṃsi ||
Translation: Ye made the firmament of larger compass, and made the regions broad for our existence.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राविष्णू हविषा वाव्र्धानाग्राद्वाना नमसा रातहव्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāviṣṇū haviṣā vāvṛdhānāghrādvānā namasā rātahavyā |
Translation: 6 Strengthened with sacred offerings, IndraViṣṇu, first eaters, served with worship ana oblation,

Sanskit Text: घर्तासुती दरविणं धत्तमस्मे समुद्रः सथः कलशः सोमधानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtāsutī draviṇaṃ dhattamasme samudraḥ sthaḥ kalaśaḥ somadhānaḥ ||
Translation: Fed with the holy oil, vouchsafe us riches ye are the lake, the vat that holds the Soma.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राविष्णू पिबतं मध्वो अस्य सोमस्य दस्रा जठरं पर्णेथाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāviṣṇū pibataṃ madhvo asya somasya dasrā jaṭharaṃ pṛṇethām |
Translation: 7 Drink of this meath, O Indra, thou, and Viṣṇu; drink ye your fill of Soma, Wonder-Workers.

Sanskit Text: आ वामन्धांसि मदिराण्यग्मन्नुप बरह्माणि शर्णुतं हवं मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāmandhāṃsi madirāṇyaghmannupa brahmāṇi śṛṇutaṃ havaṃ me ||
Translation: The sweet exhilarating juice hath reached you. Hear ye my prayers, give ear unto my calling.

Sanskit Text: उभा जिग्यथुर्न परा जयेथे न परा जिग्ये कतरश्चनैनोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhā jighyathurna parā jayethe na parā jighye kataraścanainoḥ |
Translation: 8 Ye Twain have conquered, ne’er have yc been conquered: never hath either of the Twain been vanquished.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रश्च विष्णो यदपस्प्र्धेथां तरेधा सहस्रं वि तदैरयेथाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraśca viṣṇo yadapaspṛdhethāṃ tredhā sahasraṃ vi tadairayethām ||
Translation: Ye, Indra-Viṣṇu, when ye fought the battle, produced this infinite with three divisions.

Sanskit Text: घर्तवती भुवनानामभिश्रियोर्वी पर्थ्वी मधुदुघे सुपेशसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtavatī bhuvanānāmabhiśriyorvī pṛthvī madhudughe supeśasā |
Translation: 1. FILLED full of fatness, compassing all things that be, wide, spacious, dropping meath, beautiful in their form,

Sanskit Text: दयावाप्र्थिवी वरुणस्य धर्मणा विष्कभिते अजरेभूरिरेतसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇasya dharmaṇā viṣkabhite ajarebhūriretasā ||
Translation: The Heaven and the Earth by Varuṇa's decree, unwasting, rich in germs, stand parted each from each.

Sanskit Text: असश्चन्ती भूरिधारे पयस्वती घर्तं दुहाते सुक्र्ते शुचिव्रते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asaścantī bhūridhāre payasvatī ghṛtaṃ duhāte sukṛte śucivrate |
Translation: 2 The Everlasting Pair, with full streams, rich in milk, in their pure rule pour fatness for the pious man.

Sanskit Text: राजन्ती अस्य भुवनस्य रोदसी अस्मे रेतः सिञ्चतंयन मनुर्हितम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājantī asya bhuvanasya rodasī asme retaḥ siñcataṃyan manurhitam ||
Translation: Ye who are Regents of this world, O Earth and Heaven, pour into us the genial flow that prospers meit.

Sanskit Text: यो वां रजवे करमणाय रोदसी मर्तो ददाश धिषणे स साधति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vāṃ ṛjave kramaṇāya rodasī marto dadāśa dhiṣaṇe sa sādhati |
Translation: 3 Whoso, for righteous life, pours offerings to you, O Heaven and Earth, ye Hemispheres, that man succeeds.

Sanskit Text: पर परजाभिर्जायते धर्मणस परि युवोः सिक्ता विषुरूपाणि सव्रता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra prajābhirjāyate dharmaṇas pari yuvoḥ siktā viṣurūpāṇi savratā ||
Translation: He in his seed is born again and spreads by Law: from you flow things diverse in form, but ruled alike.

Sanskit Text: घर्तेन दयावाप्र्थिवी अभीव्र्ते घर्तश्रिया घर्तप्र्चा घर्ताव्र्धा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī abhīvṛte ghṛtaśriyā ghṛtapṛcā ghṛtāvṛdhā |
Translation: 4 Enclosed in fatness, Heaven and Earth are bright therewith: they mingle with the fatness which they still increase.

Sanskit Text: उर्वी पर्थ्वी होत्र्वूर्ये पुरोहिते ते इद विप्रा ईळते सुम्नमिष्टये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: urvī pṛthvī hotṛvūrye purohite te id viprā īḷate sumnamiṣṭaye ||
Translation: Wide, broad, set foremost at election of the priest, to them the singers pray for bliss to further them.

Sanskit Text: मधु नो दयावाप्र्थिवी मिमिक्षतां मधुश्चुता मधुदुघे मधुव्रते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhu no dyāvāpṛthivī mimikṣatāṃ madhuścutā madhudughe madhuvrate |
Translation: 5 May Heaven and Earth pour down the balmy rain for us, balm-dropping, yielding balm, with balm upon your path,

Sanskit Text: दधाने यज्ञं दरविणं च देवता महि शरवो वाजमस्मे सुवीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhāne yajñaṃ draviṇaṃ ca devatā mahi śravo vājamasme suvīryam ||
Translation: Bestowing by your Godhead sacrifice and wealth, great fame and strength for us and good heroic might.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्जं नो दयौश्च पर्थिवी च पिन्वतां पिता माता विश्वविदा सुदंससा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrjaṃ no dyauśca pṛthivī ca pinvatāṃ pitā mātā viśvavidā sudaṃsasā |
Translation: 6 May Heaven and Earth make food swell plenteously for us, all-knowing Father, jother, wondrous in their works.

Sanskit Text: संरराणे रोदसी विश्वशम्भुवा सनिं वाजं रयिमस्मे समिन्वताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃrarāṇe rodasī viśvaśambhuvā saniṃ vājaṃ rayimasme saminvatām ||
Translation: Pouring out bounties, may, in union, both the Worlds, all beneficial, send us gain, and power, and wealth.

Sanskit Text: उदु षय देवः सविता हिरण्यया बाहू अयंस्त सवनायसुक्रतुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udu ṣya devaḥ savitā hiraṇyayā bāhū ayaṃsta savanāyasukratuḥ |
Translation: 1. FULL of effectual wisdom Savitar the God hath stretched out golden arms that he may bring forth life.

Sanskit Text: घर्तेन पाणी अभि परुष्णुते मखो युवा सुदक्षो रजसो विधर्मणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtena pāṇī abhi pruṣṇute makho yuvā sudakṣo rajaso vidharmaṇi ||
Translation: Young and most skilful, while he holds the region up, the Warrior sprinkles fatness over both his hands.

Sanskit Text: देवस्य वयं सवितुः सवीमनि शरेष्ठे सयाम वसुनश्चदावने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devasya vayaṃ savituḥ savīmani śreṣṭhe syāma vasunaścadāvane |
Translation: 2 May we enjoy the noblest vivifying force of Savitar the God, that he may give us wealth:

Sanskit Text: यो विश्वस्य दविपदो यश्चतुष्पदो निवेशने परसवे चासि भूमनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo viśvasya dvipado yaścatuṣpado niveśane prasave cāsi bhūmanaḥ ||
Translation: For thou art mighty to produce and lull to rest the world of life that moves on two feet and on four.

Sanskit Text: अदब्धेभिः सवितः पायुभिष टवं शिवेभिरद्य परि पाहि नो गयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adabdhebhiḥ savitaḥ pāyubhiṣ ṭvaṃ śivebhiradya pari pāhi no ghayam |
Translation: 3 Protect our habitation, Savitar, this day, with guardian aids around, auspicious, firm and true.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यजिह्वः सुविताय नव्यसे रक्षा माकिर्नोघशंस ईशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyajihvaḥ suvitāya navyase rakṣā mākirnoaghaśaṃsa īśata ||
Translation: God of the golden tongue, keep us for newest bliss: let not the evil-wisher have us in his power.

Sanskit Text: उदु षय देवः सविता दमूना हिरण्यपाणिः परतिदोषमस्थात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udu ṣya devaḥ savitā damūnā hiraṇyapāṇiḥ pratidoṣamasthāt |
Translation: 4 This Savitar the God, the golden-handed, Friend of the home, hath risen to meet the twilight.

Sanskit Text: अयोहनुर्यजतो मन्द्रजिह्व आ दाशुषे सुवति भूरिवामम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayohanuryajato mandrajihva ā dāśuṣe suvati bhūrivāmam ||
Translation: With cheeks of brass, with pleasant tongue, the Holy, he sends the worshipper rich gifts in plenty.

Sanskit Text: उदू अयानुपवक्तेव बाहू हिरण्यया सविता सुप्रतीका |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udū ayānupavakteva bāhū hiraṇyayā savitā supratīkā |
Translation: 5 Like a Director, Savitar hath extended his golden arms, exceeding fair to look on.

Sanskit Text: दिवो रोहांस्यरुहत पर्थिव्या अरीरमत पतयत कच्चिदभ्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo rohāṃsyaruhat pṛthivyā arīramat patayat kaccidabhvam ||
Translation: He hath gone up the heights of earth and heaven, and made each monster fall and cease from troubling.

Sanskit Text: वाममद्य सवितर्वाममु शवो दिवे-दिवे वाममस्मभ्यं सावीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāmamadya savitarvāmamu śvo dive-dive vāmamasmabhyaṃ sāvīḥ |
Translation: 6 Fair wealth, O Savitar, to-day, to-morrow, fair wealth produce for us each day that passes.

Sanskit Text: वामस्य हि कषयस्य देव भूरेरया धिया वामभाजः सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāmasya hi kṣayasya deva bhūrerayā dhiyā vāmabhājaḥ syāma ||
Translation: May we through this our song be happy gainers, God, of a fair and spacious habitation.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रासोमा महि तद वां महित्वं युवं महानि परथमानि चक्रथुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāsomā mahi tad vāṃ mahitvaṃ yuvaṃ mahāni prathamāni cakrathuḥ |
Translation: 1. GREAT is this might of yours, Indra and Soma: the first high exploits were your own achievements.

Sanskit Text: युवं सूर्यं विविदथुर्युवं सवर्विश्वा तमांस्यहतं निदश्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ sūryaṃ vividathuryuvaṃ svarviśvā tamāṃsyahataṃ nidaśca ||
Translation: Ye found the Sun ye found the light of heaven: ye killed all darkness and the Gods’ blasphemers.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रासोमा वासयथ उषासमुत सूर्यं नयथो जयोतिषा सह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāsomā vāsayatha uṣāsamut sūryaṃ nayatho jyotiṣā saha |
Translation: 2 Ye, Indra-Soma, gave her light to Morning, and led the Sun on high with all his splendour.

Sanskit Text: उप दयां सकम्भथुः सकम्भनेनाप्रथतं पर्थिवीं मातरं वि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa dyāṃ skambhathuḥ skambhanenāprathataṃ pṛthivīṃ mātaraṃ vi ||
Translation: Ye stayed the heaven with a supporting pillar, and spread abroad apart, the Earth, the Mother.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रासोमावहिमपः परिष्ठां हथो वर्त्रमनु वां दयौरमन्यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāsomāvahimapaḥ pariṣṭhāṃ hatho vṛtramanu vāṃ dyauramanyata |
Translation: 3 Ye slew the flood -obstructing serpent Vṛtra, Indra and Soma: Heaven approved your exploit.
