Sanskit Text: परार्णांस्यैरयतं नदीनामा समुद्राणिपप्रथुः पुरूणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prārṇāṃsyairayataṃ nadīnāmā samudrāṇipaprathuḥ purūṇi ||
Translation: Ye urged to speed the currents of the rivers, and many seas have ye filled full with waters.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रासोमा पक्वमामास्वन्तर्नि गवामिद दधथुर्वक्षणासु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāsomā pakvamāmāsvantarni ghavāmid dadhathurvakṣaṇāsu |
Translation: 4 Ye in the unripe udders of the milch-kine have set the ripe milk, Indra, thou, and Soma.

Sanskit Text: जग्र्भथुरनपिनद्धमासु रुशच्चित्रासु जगतीष्वन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jaghṛbhathuranapinaddhamāsu ruśaccitrāsu jaghatīṣvantaḥ ||
Translation: Ye have held fast the unimpeded whiteness within these many-coloured moving creatures.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रासोमा युवमङग तरुत्रमपत्यसाचं शरुत्यं रराथे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāsomā yuvamaṅgha tarutramapatyasācaṃ śrutyaṃ rarāthe |
Translation: 5 Verily ye bestow, Indra and Soma, wealth, famed, victorious, passing to our children.

Sanskit Text: युवं शुष्मं नर्यं चर्षणिभ्यः सं विव्यथुः पर्तनाषाहमुग्रा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ śuṣmaṃ naryaṃ carṣaṇibhyaḥ saṃ vivyathuḥ pṛtanāṣāhamughrā ||
Translation: Ye have invested men, ye Mighty Beings, with manly strength that conquers in the battle.

Sanskit Text: यो अद्रिभित परथमजा रतावा बर्हस्पतिराङगिरसो हविष्मान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo adribhit prathamajā ṛtāvā bṛhaspatirāṅghiraso haviṣmān |
Translation: 1. SERVED with oblations, first-born, mountain-render, Aṅgiras' son, Bṛhaspati, the Holy,

Sanskit Text: दविबर्हज्मा पराघर्मसत पिता न आ रोदसी वर्षभो रोरवीति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvibarhajmā prāgharmasat pitā na ā rodasī vṛṣabho roravīti ||
Translation: With twice-firm path, dwelling in light, our Father, roars loudly, as a bull, to Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: जनाय चिद य ईवत उ लोकं बर्हस्पतिर्देवहूतौ चकार |
Sanskrit Transliteration: janāya cid ya īvata u lokaṃ bṛhaspatirdevahūtau cakāra |
Translation: 2 Bṛhaspati, who made for such a people wide room and verge when Gods were invocated,

Sanskit Text: घनन वर्त्राणि वि पुरो दर्दरीति जयञ्छत्रून्रमित्रान पर्त्सु साहन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghnan vṛtrāṇi vi puro dardarīti jayañchatrūnramitrān pṛtsu sāhan ||
Translation: Slaying his enemies, breaks down their castles, quelling his foes and conquering those who hate him.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिः समजयद वसूनि महो वरजान गोमतो देव एषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiḥ samajayad vasūni maho vrajān ghomato deva eṣaḥ |
Translation: 3 Bṛhaspati in war hath won rich treasures, hath won, this God, the great stalls filled with cattle.

Sanskit Text: अपः सिषासन सवरप्रतीतो बर्हस्पतिर्हन्त्यमित्रमर्कैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apaḥ siṣāsan svarapratīto bṛhaspatirhantyamitramarkaiḥ ||
Translation: Striving to win waters and light, resistless, Bṛhaspati with lightning smites the foeman.

Sanskit Text: सोमारुद्रा धारयेथामसुर्यं पर वामिष्टयो.अरमश्नुवन्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somārudrā dhārayethāmasuryaṃ pra vāmiṣṭayo.aramaśnuvantu |
Translation: 1. HOLD fast your Godlike sway, O Soma-Rudra: let these our sacrifices quickly reach you.

Sanskit Text: दमे-दमे सप्त रत्ना दधाना शं नो भूतं दविपदेशं चतुष्पदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dame-dame sapta ratnā dadhānā śaṃ no bhūtaṃ dvipadeśaṃ catuṣpade ||
Translation: Placing in every house your seven great treasures, bring blessing to our quadrupeds and bipeds.

Sanskit Text: सोमारुद्रा वि वर्हतं विषूचीममीवा या नो गयमाविवेश |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somārudrā vi vṛhataṃ viṣūcīmamīvā yā no ghayamāviveśa |
Translation: 2 Soma and Rudra, chase to every quarter the sickness that hath visited our dwelling.

Sanskit Text: आरे बाधेथां निरतिं पराचैरस्मे भद्रा सौश्रवसानि सन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āre bādhethāṃ nirtiṃ parācairasme bhadrā sauśravasāni santu ||
Translation: Drive Nirrti away into the distance, and give us excellent and happy glories.

Sanskit Text: सोमारुद्रा युवमेतान्यस्मे विश्वा तनूषु भेषजानि धत्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somārudrā yuvametānyasme viśvā tanūṣu bheṣajāni dhattam |
Translation: 3 Provide, O Soma-Rudra, for our bodies all needful medicines to heal and cure us.

Sanskit Text: अव सयतं मुञ्चतं यन नो अस्ति तनूषु बद्धं कर्तमेनो अस्मत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava syataṃ muñcataṃ yan no asti tanūṣu baddhaṃ kṛtameno asmat ||
Translation: Set free and draw away the sin committed which we have still inherent in our persons.

Sanskit Text: तिग्मायुधौ तिग्महेती सुशेवौ सोमारुद्राविह सु मर्ळतं नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tighmāyudhau tighmahetī suśevau somārudrāviha su mṛḷataṃ naḥ |
Translation: 4 Armed with keen shafts and weapons, kind and loving, be gracious unto us, Soma and Rudra.

Sanskit Text: पर नो मुञ्चतं वरुणस्य पाशाद गोपायतं नः सुमनस्यमाना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra no muñcataṃ varuṇasya pāśād ghopāyataṃ naḥ sumanasyamānā ||
Translation: Release us from the noose of Varuṇa; keep us from sorrow, in your tender loving-kindness.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं वो देवमग्निभिः सजोषा यजिष्ठं दूतमध्वरेक्र्णुध्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ vo devamaghnibhiḥ sajoṣā yajiṣṭhaṃ dūtamadhvarekṛṇudhvam |
Translation: 1. ASSOCIATE with fires, make your God Agni envoy at sacrifice, best skilled in worship,

Sanskit Text: यो मर्त्येषु निध्रुविरतावा तपुर्मूर्धा घर्तान्नः पावकः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo martyeṣu nidhruvirtāvā tapurmūrdhā ghṛtānnaḥ pāvakaḥ ||
Translation: Established firm among mankind, the Holy, flame-crowned and fed with oil, the Purifier.

Sanskit Text: परोथदश्वो न यवसे.अविष्यन यदा महः संवरणाद वयस्थात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prothadaśvo na yavase.aviṣyan yadā mahaḥ saṃvaraṇād vyasthāt |
Translation: 2 Like a steed neighing eager for the pasture, when he hath stepped forth from the great enclosure:

Sanskit Text: आदस्य वातो अनु वाति शोचिरध सम ते वरजनं कर्ष्णमस्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādasya vāto anu vāti śociradha sma te vrajanaṃ kṛṣṇamasti ||
Translation: Then the wind following blows upon his splendour, and, straight, the path is black which thou hast travelled.

Sanskit Text: उद यस्य ते नवजातस्य वर्ष्णो.अग्ने चरन्त्यजरा इधानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud yasya te navajātasya vṛṣṇo.aghne carantyajarā idhānāḥ |
Translation: 3 From thee a Bull but newly born, O Agni, the kindled everlasting flames rise upward.

Sanskit Text: अछा दयामरुषो धूम एति सं दूतो अग्न ईयसे हि देवान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā dyāmaruṣo dhūma eti saṃ dūto aghna īyase hi devān ||
Translation: Aloft to heaven thy ruddy smoke ascendeth: Agni, thou speedest to the Gods as envoy.

Sanskit Text: वि यस्य ते पर्थिव्यां पाजो अश्रेत तर्षु यदन्ना समव्र्क्तजम्भैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yasya te pṛthivyāṃ pājo aśret tṛṣu yadannā samavṛktajambhaiḥ |
Translation: 4 Thou whose fresh lustre o’er the earth advanceth when greedily with thy jaws thy food thou eatest.

Sanskit Text: सेनेव सर्ष्टा परसितिष ट एति यवं न दस्म जुह्वा विवेक्षि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: seneva sṛṣṭā prasitiṣ ṭa eti yavaṃ na dasma juhvā vivekṣi ||
Translation: Like a host hurried onward comes thy lasso: fierce, with thy tongue thou piercest, as ’twere barley.

Sanskit Text: तमिद दोषा तमुषसि यविष्ठमग्निमत्यं न मर्जयन्त नरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamid doṣā tamuṣasi yaviṣṭhamaghnimatyaṃ na marjayanta naraḥ |
Translation: 5 The men have decked him both at eve and morning, Most Youthful Agni, as they tend a courser.

Sanskit Text: निशिशाना अतिथिमस्य योनौ दीदाय शोचिराहुतस्य वर्ष्णः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niśiśānā atithimasya yonau dīdāya śocirāhutasya vṛṣṇaḥ ||
Translation: They kindle him, a guest within his dwelling: bright shines the splendour of the worshipped Hero.

Sanskit Text: सुसन्द्र्क ते सवनीक परतीकं वि यद रुक्मो न रोचस उपाके |
Sanskrit Transliteration: susandṛk te svanīka pratīkaṃ vi yad rukmo na rocasa upāke |
Translation: 6 O fair of face, beautiful is thine aspect when, very near at hand, like gold thou gleamest,

Sanskit Text: दिवो न ते तन्यतुरेति शुष्मश्चित्रो न सूरः परति चक्षि भानुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo na te tanyatureti śuṣmaścitro na sūraḥ prati cakṣi bhānum ||
Translation: Like Heaven's thundering roar thy might approaches, and like the wondrous Sun thy light thou showest.

Sanskit Text: यथा वः सवाहाग्नये दाशेम परीळाभिर्घ्र्तवद्भिश्च हव्यैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā vaḥ svāhāghnaye dāśema parīḷābhirghṛtavadbhiśca havyaiḥ |
Translation: 7 That we may worship, with your Hail to Agni! with sacrificial cakes and fat oblations,

Sanskit Text: तेभिर्नो अग्ने अमितैर्महोभिः शतं पूर्भिरायसीभिर्नि पाहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tebhirno aghne amitairmahobhiḥ śataṃ pūrbhirāyasībhirni pāhi ||
Translation: Guard us, O Agni, with those boundless glories as with a hundred fortresses of iron.

Sanskit Text: या वा ते सन्ति दाशुषे अध्र्ष्टा गिरो वा याभिर्न्र्वतीरुरुष्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā vā te santi dāśuṣe adhṛṣṭā ghiro vā yābhirnṛvatīruruṣyāḥ |
Translation: 8 Thine are resistless songs for him who offers, and hero-giving hymns wherewith thou savest;

Sanskit Text: ताभिर्नः सूनो सहसो नि पाहि समत सूरीञ जरितॄञ जातवेदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tābhirnaḥ sūno sahaso ni pāhi smat sūrīñ jaritṝñ jātavedaḥ ||
Translation: With these, O Son of Strength, O Jātavedas, guard us, preserve these princes and the singers.

Sanskit Text: निर्यत पूतेव सवधितिः शुचिर्गात सवया कर्पा तन्वा रोचमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: niryat pūteva svadhitiḥ śucirghāt svayā kṛpā tanvā rocamānaḥ |
Translation: 9 When forth he cometh, like an axe new-sharpened, pure in his form, resplendent in his body,

Sanskit Text: आ यो मात्रोरुशेन्यो जनिष्ट देवयज्याय सुक्रतुः पावकः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yo mātroruśenyo janiṣṭa devayajyāya sukratuḥ pāvakaḥ ||
Translation: Sprung, sought with eager longing, from his Parents, for the Gods’ worship, Sage and Purifier:

Sanskit Text: एता नो अग्ने सौभगा दिदीह्यपि करतुं सुचेतसं वतेम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etā no aghne saubhaghā didīhyapi kratuṃ sucetasaṃ vatema |
Translation: 10 Shine this felicity on us, O Agni: may we attain to perfect understanding.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा सतोत्र्भ्यो गर्णते च सन्तु यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā stotṛbhyo ghṛṇate ca santu yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: All happiness be theirs who sing and praise thee. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

Sanskit Text: पराग्नये तवसे भरध्वं गिरं दिवो अरतये पर्थिव्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāghnaye tavase bharadhvaṃ ghiraṃ divo arataye pṛthivyāḥ |
Translation: 1. BRING forth your song of praise to mighty Agni, the speedy messenger of earth and heaven,

Sanskit Text: यो विश्वेषामम्र्तानामुपस्थे वैश्वानरो वाव्र्धे जाग्र्वद्भिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo viśveṣāmamṛtānāmupasthe vaiśvānaro vāvṛdhe jāghṛvadbhiḥ ||
Translation: Vaiśvānara, who, with those who wake, hath waxen great in the lap of all the Gods Immortal.

Sanskit Text: पर्ष्टो दिवि धाय्यग्निः पर्थिव्यां नेता सिन्धूनां वर्षभ सतियानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛṣṭo divi dhāyyaghniḥ pṛthivyāṃ netā sindhūnāṃ vṛṣabha stiyānām |
Translation: 2 Sought in the heavens, on earth is Agni stablished, leader of rivers, Bull of standing waters.

Sanskit Text: स मानुषीरभि विशो वि भाति वैश्वानरो वाव्र्धानो वरेण ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa mānuṣīrabhi viśo vi bhāti vaiśvānaro vāvṛdhāno vareṇa ||
Translation: Vaiśvānara when he hath grown in glory, shines on the tribes of men with light and treasure.

Sanskit Text: तवद भिया विश आयन्नसिक्नीरसमना जहतीर्भोजनानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvad bhiyā viśa āyannasiknīrasamanā jahatīrbhojanāni |
Translation: 3 For fear of thee forth fled the dark-hued races, scattered abroad, deserting their possessions,

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानर पूरवे शोशुचानः पुरो यदग्ने दरयन्नदीदेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānara pūrave śośucānaḥ puro yadaghne darayannadīdeḥ ||
Translation: When, glowing, O Vaiśvānara, for Pūru, thou Agni didst light up and rend their castles.

Sanskit Text: तव तरिधातु पर्थिवी उत दयौर्वैश्वानर वरतमग्ने सचन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava tridhātu pṛthivī uta dyaurvaiśvānara vratamaghne sacanta |
Translation: 4 Agni Vaiśvānara, both Earth and Heaven submit them to thy threefold jurisdiction.

Sanskit Text: तवं भासा रोदसी आ ततन्थाजस्रेण शोचिषा शोशुचानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ bhāsā rodasī ā tatanthājasreṇa śociṣā śośucānaḥ ||
Translation: Refulgent in thine undecaying lustre thou hast invested both the worlds with splendour.

Sanskit Text: तवामग्ने हरितो वावशाना गिरः सचन्ते धुनयो घर्ताचीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmaghne harito vāvaśānā ghiraḥ sacante dhunayo ghṛtācīḥ |
Translation: 5 Agni, the tawny horses, loudly neighing our resonant hymns that drop with oil, attend thee;

Sanskit Text: पतिं कर्ष्टीनां रथ्यं रयीणां वैश्वानरमुषसां केतुमह्नाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: patiṃ kṛṣṭīnāṃ rathyaṃ rayīṇāṃ vaiśvānaramuṣasāṃ ketumahnām ||
Translation: Lord of the tribes, our Charioteer of riches, Ensign of days, Vaiśvānara of mornings.

Sanskit Text: तवे असुर्यं वसवो नय रण्वन करतुं हि ते मित्रमहो जुषन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve asuryaṃ vasavo ny ṛṇvan kratuṃ hi te mitramaho juṣanta |
Translation: 6 In thee, O bright as Mitra, Vasus seated the might of Aduras, for they loved thy spirit.

Sanskit Text: तवं दस्यून्रोकसो अग्न आज उरु जयोतिर्जनयन्नार्याय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ dasyūnrokaso aghna āja uru jyotirjanayannāryāya ||
Translation: Thou dravest Dasyus from their home, O Agni, and broughtest forth broad light to light the Ārya.

Sanskit Text: स जायमानः परमे वयोमन वायुर्न पाथः परि पासि सद्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyoman vāyurna pāthaḥ pari pāsi sadyaḥ |
Translation: 7 Born in the loftiest heaven thou in a moment reachest, like wind, the place where Gods inhabit.

Sanskit Text: तवं भुवना जनयन्नभि करन्नपत्याय जातवेदो दशस्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ bhuvanā janayannabhi krannapatyāya jātavedo daśasyan ||
Translation: Thou, favouring thine offspring, roaredst loudly when giving life to creatures, Jātavedas.

Sanskit Text: तामग्ने अस्मे इषमेरयस्व वैश्वानर दयुमतीं जातवेदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāmaghne asme iṣamerayasva vaiśvānara dyumatīṃ jātavedaḥ |
Translation: 8 Send us that strength, Vaiśvānara, send it, Agni, that strength, O Jātavedas, full of splendour,

Sanskit Text: यया राधः पिन्वसि विश्ववार पर्थु शरवो दाशुषे मर्त्याय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayā rādhaḥ pinvasi viśvavāra pṛthu śravo dāśuṣe martyāya ||
Translation: Wherewith, all-bounteous God, thou pourest riches, as fame wide-spreading, on the man who offers.

Sanskit Text: तं नो अग्ने मघवद्भ्यः पुरुक्षुं रयिं नि वाजं शरुत्यं युवस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ no aghne maghavadbhyaḥ purukṣuṃ rayiṃ ni vājaṃ śrutyaṃ yuvasva |
Translation: 9 Agni, bestow upon our chiefs and nobles that famous power, that wealth which feedeth many.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानर महि नः शर्म यछ रुद्रेभिरग्ने वसुभिः सजोषाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānara mahi naḥ śarma yacha rudrebhiraghne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ ||
Translation: Accordant with the Vasus and the Rudras, Agni, Vaiśvānara, give us sure protection.

Sanskit Text: पर सम्राजो असुरस्य परशस्तिं पुंसः कर्ष्टीनामनुमाद्यस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra samrājo asurasya praśastiṃ puṃsaḥ kṛṣṭīnāmanumādyasya |
Translation: 1. PRAISE of the Asura, high imperial Ruler, the Manly One in whom the folk shall triumph-

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्येव पर तवसस कर्तानि वन्दे दारुं वन्दमानोविवक्मि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasyeva pra tavasas kṛtāni vande dāruṃ vandamānovivakmi ||
Translation: I laud his deeds who is as strong as Indra, and lauding celebrate the Fort-destroyer.

Sanskit Text: कविं केतुं धासिं भानुमद्रेर्हिन्वन्ति शं राज्यं रोदस्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaviṃ ketuṃ dhāsiṃ bhānumadrerhinvanti śaṃ rājyaṃ rodasyoḥ |
Translation: 2 Sage, Sing, Food, Light,—they bring him from the mountain, the blessed Sovran of the earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: पुरन्दरस्य गीर्भिरा विवासे.अग्नेर्व्रतानि पूर्व्या महानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purandarasya ghīrbhirā vivāse.aghnervratāni pūrvyā mahāni ||
Translation: I decorate with songs the mighty actions which Agni, Fort-destroyer, did aforetime.

Sanskit Text: नयक्रतून गरथिनो मर्ध्रवाचः पणीन्रश्रद्धानव्र्धानयज्ञान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nyakratūn ghrathino mṛdhravācaḥ paṇīnraśraddhānavṛdhānayajñān |
Translation: 3 The foolish, faithless, rudely-speaking niggards, without belief or sacrifice or worship,—

Sanskit Text: पर-पर तान दस्यून्रग्निर्विवाय पूर्वश्चकारापरानयज्यून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra-pra tān dasyūnraghnirvivāya pūrvaścakārāparānayajyūn ||
Translation: Far far sway hath Agni chased those Dasytis, and, in the cast, hath turned the godless westward.

Sanskit Text: यो अपाचीने तमसि मदन्तीः पराचीश्चकार नर्तमः शचीभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo apācīne tamasi madantīḥ prācīścakāra nṛtamaḥ śacībhiḥ |
Translation: 4 Him who brought eastward, manliest with his prowess, the Maids rejoicing in the western darkness,

Sanskit Text: तमीशानं वस्वो अग्निं गर्णीषे.अनानतं दमयन्तं पर्तन्यून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamīśānaṃ vasvo aghniṃ ghṛṇīṣe.anānataṃ damayantaṃ pṛtanyūn ||
Translation: That Agni I extol, the Lord of riches, unyielding tamer of assailing foemen.

Sanskit Text: यो देह्यो अनमयद वधस्नैर्यो अर्यपत्नीरुषसश्चकार |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo dehyo anamayad vadhasnairyo aryapatnīruṣasaścakāra |
Translation: 5 Him who brake down the walls with deadly weapons, and gave the Mornings to anoble Husband,

Sanskit Text: स निरुध्या नहुषो यज्वो अग्निर्विशश्चक्रे बलिह्र्तः सहोभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa nirudhyā nahuṣo yajvo aghnirviśaścakre balihṛtaḥ sahobhiḥ ||
Translation: Young Agni, who with conquering strength subduing the tribes of Nahus made them bring their tribute.

Sanskit Text: यस्य शर्मन्नुप विश्वे जनास एवैस्तस्थुः सुमतिं भिक्षमाणाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya śarmannupa viśve janāsa evaistasthuḥ sumatiṃ bhikṣamāṇāḥ |
Translation: 6 In whose protection all men rest by nature, desiring to enjoy his gracious favour-

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानरो वरमा रोदस्योराग्निः ससाद पित्रोरुपस्थम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānaro varamā rodasyorāghniḥ sasāda pitrorupastham ||
Translation: Agni Vaiśvānara in his Parents, bosom hath found the choicest seat in earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: आ देवो ददे बुध्न्या वसूनि वैश्वानर उदिता सूर्यस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā devo dade budhnyā vasūni vaiśvānara uditā sūryasya |
Translation: 7 Vaiśvānara the God, at the sun's setting, hath taken to himself deep-hidden treasures:

Sanskit Text: आ समुद्रादवरादा परस्मादाग्निर्ददे दिव आ पर्थिव्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā samudrādavarādā parasmādāghnirdade diva ā pṛthivyāḥ ||
Translation: Agni hath taken them from earth and heaven, from the sea under and the sea above us.

Sanskit Text: पर वो देवं चित सहसानमग्निमश्वं न वाजिनं हिषे नमोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vo devaṃ cit sahasānamaghnimaśvaṃ na vājinaṃ hiṣe namobhiḥ |
Translation: 1. I SEND forth even your God, victorious Agni, like a strong courser, with mine adoration.

Sanskit Text: भवा नो दूतो अध्वरस्य विद्वान तमना देवेषु विविदे मितद्रुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhavā no dūto adhvarasya vidvān tmanā deveṣu vivide mitadruḥ ||
Translation: Herald of sacrifice be he who knoweth he hath reached Gods, himself, with measured motion.

Sanskit Text: आ याह्यग्ने पथ्या अनु सवा मन्द्रो देवानां सख्यं जुषाणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yāhyaghne pathyā anu svā mandro devānāṃ sakhyaṃ juṣāṇaḥ |
Translation: 2 By paths that are thine own come hither, Agni, joyous, delighting in the Gods’ alliance,

Sanskit Text: आ सानु शुष्मैर्नदयन पर्थिव्या जम्भेभिर्विश्वमुशधग वनानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā sānu śuṣmairnadayan pṛthivyā jambhebhirviśvamuśadhagh vanāni ||
Translation: Making the heights of earth roar with thy fury, burning with eager teeth the woods and forests.

Sanskit Text: पराचीनो यज्ञः सुधितं हि बर्हिः परीणीते अग्निरीळितो न होता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prācīno yajñaḥ sudhitaṃ hi barhiḥ prīṇīte aghnirīḷito na hotā |
Translation: 3 The grass is strewn; the sacrifice advances adored as Priest, Agni is made propitious,

Sanskit Text: आ मातरा विश्ववारे हुवानो यतो यविष्ठ जज्ञिषे सुशेवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā mātarā viśvavāre huvāno yato yaviṣṭha jajñiṣe suśevaḥ ||
Translation: Invoking both All-boon-bestowing Mothers of whom, Most Youthful! thou wast born to help us.

Sanskit Text: सद्यो अध्वरे रथिरं जनन्त मानुषासो विचेतसो य एषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadyo adhvare rathiraṃ jananta mānuṣāso vicetaso ya eṣām |
Translation: 4 Forthwith the men, the best of these for wisdom, have made him leader in the solemn worship.

Sanskit Text: विशामधायि विश्पतिर्दुरोणे.अग्निर्मन्द्रो मधुवचा रतावा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśāmadhāyi viśpatirduroṇe.aghnirmandro madhuvacā ṛtāvā ||
Translation: As Lord in homes of men is Agni stablished, the Holy One, the joyous, sweetly speaking.

Sanskit Text: असादि वर्तो वह्निराजगन्वानग्निर्ब्रह्मा नर्षदने विधर्ता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asādi vṛto vahnirājaghanvānaghnirbrahmā nṛṣadane vidhartā |
Translation: 5 He hath come, chosen bearer, and is seated in man's home, Brahman, Agni, the Supporter,

Sanskit Text: दयौश्च यं पर्थिवी वाव्र्धाते आ यं होता यजति विश्ववारम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyauśca yaṃ pṛthivī vāvṛdhāte ā yaṃ hotā yajati viśvavāram ||
Translation: He whom both Heaven anct Earth exalt and strengthenwhom, Giver of all boons, the Hotar worships.

Sanskit Text: एते दयुम्नेभिर्विश्वमातिरन्त मन्त्रं ये वारं नर्या अतक्षन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete dyumnebhirviśvamātiranta mantraṃ ye vāraṃ naryā atakṣan |
Translation: 6 These have passed all in glory, who, the manly, have wrought with skill the hymn of adoration;

Sanskit Text: पर ये विशस्तिरन्त शरोषमाणा आ ये मे अस्य दीधयन्न्र्तस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ye viśastiranta śroṣamāṇā ā ye me asya dīdhayannṛtasya ||
Translation: Who, listening, have advanced the people's welfare, and set their thoughts on this my holy statute.

Sanskit Text: नू तवामग्न ईमहे वसिष्ठा ईशानं सूनो सहसो वसूनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū tvāmaghna īmahe vasiṣṭhā īśānaṃ sūno sahaso vasūnām |
Translation: 7 We, the Vasisthas, now implore thee, Agni, O Son of Strength, the Lord of wealth and treasure.

Sanskit Text: इषं सतोत्र्भ्यो मघवद्भ्य आनड यूयं पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣaṃ stotṛbhyo maghavadbhya ānaḍ yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ ||
Translation: Thou hast brought food to singers and to nobles. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

Sanskit Text: अबोधि जार उषसामुपस्थाद धोता मन्द्रः कवितमः पावकः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abodhi jāra uṣasāmupasthād dhotā mandraḥ kavitamaḥ pāvakaḥ |
Translation: 1. ROUSED from their bosom is the Dawns' beloved, the joyous Priest, most sapient, Purifier.

Sanskit Text: दधाति केतुमुभयस्य जन्तोर्हव्या देवेषु दरविणं सुक्र्त्सु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhāti ketumubhayasya jantorhavyā deveṣu draviṇaṃ sukṛtsu ||
Translation: He gives a signal both to Gods and mortals, to Gods oblations, riches to the pious.

Sanskit Text: स सुक्रतुर्यो वि दुरः पणीनां पुनानो अर्कं पुरुभोजसं नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sukraturyo vi duraḥ paṇīnāṃ punāno arkaṃ purubhojasaṃ naḥ |
Translation: 2 Most wise is he who, forcing doors of Paṇis, brought the bright Sun to us who feedeth many.

Sanskit Text: होता मन्द्रो विशां दमूनास्तिरस्तमो दद्र्शे राम्याणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotā mandro viśāṃ damūnāstirastamo dadṛśe rāmyāṇām ||
Translation: The cheerful Priest, men's Friend and home-companion, through still night's darkness he is made apparent.

Sanskit Text: अमूरः कविरदितिर्विवस्वान सुसंसन मित्रो अतिथिः शिवोनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: amūraḥ kaviraditirvivasvān susaṃsan mitro atithiḥ śivonaḥ |
Translation: 3 Wise, ne.'er deceived, uncircumscribed, refulgent, our gracious guest, a Friend with good attendants,

Sanskit Text: चित्रभानुरुषसां भात्यग्रे.अपां गर्भः परस्वा विवेश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: citrabhānuruṣasāṃ bhātyaghre.apāṃ gharbhaḥ prasvaā viveśa ||
Translation: Shines forth with wondrous light before the Mornings; the young plants hath he entered, Child of Waters.

Sanskit Text: ईळेन्यो वो मनुषो युगेषु समनगा अशुचज्जातवेदाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īḷenyo vo manuṣo yugheṣu samanaghā aśucajjātavedāḥ |
Translation: 4 Seeking our gatherings, he, your Jātavedas, hath shone adorable through human ages,

Sanskit Text: सुसन्द्र्शा भानुना यो विभाति परति गावः समिधानं बुधन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: susandṛśā bhānunā yo vibhāti prati ghāvaḥ samidhānaṃ budhanta ||
Translation: Who gleams refulgent with his lovely lustre: the kine have waked to meet him when enkindled.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने याहि दूत्यं मा रिषण्यो देवानछा बरह्मक्र्ता गणेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne yāhi dūtyaṃ mā riṣaṇyo devānachā brahmakṛtā ghaṇena |
Translation: 5 Go on thy message to the Gods, and fail not, O Agni, with their band who pray and worship.

Sanskit Text: सरस्वतीं मरुतो अश्विनापो यक्षि देवान रत्नधेयायविश्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarasvatīṃ maruto aśvināpo yakṣi devān ratnadheyāyaviśvān ||
Translation: Bring all the Gods that they may give us riches, Sarasvatī, the Maruts, Aśvins, Waters.

Sanskit Text: तवामग्ने समिधानो वसिष्ठो जरूथं हन यक्षि राये पुरन्धिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmaghne samidhāno vasiṣṭho jarūthaṃ han yakṣi rāye purandhim |
Translation: 6 Vasiṣṭha, when enkindling thee, O Agni, hath slain jarutha. Give us wealth in plenty.

Sanskit Text: पुरुणीथा जातवेदो जरस्व यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: puruṇīthā jātavedo jarasva yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Sing praise in choral song, O Jātavedas. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

Sanskit Text: उषो न जारः पर्थु पाजो अश्रेद दविद्युतद दीद्यच्छोशुचानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣo na jāraḥ pṛthu pājo aśred davidyutad dīdyacchośucānaḥ |
Translation: 1. HE hath sent forth, bright, radiant, and refulgent, like the Dawn's Lover, his far-spreading lustre.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा हरिः शुचिरा भाति भासा धियो हिन्वान उशतीरजीगः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā hariḥ śucirā bhāti bhāsā dhiyo hinvāna uśatīrajīghaḥ ||
Translation: Pure in his splendour shines the golden Hero: our longing thoughts hath he aroused and wakened.

Sanskit Text: सवर्ण वस्तोरुषसामरोचि यज्ञं तन्वाना उशिजो न मन्म |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svarṇa vastoruṣasāmaroci yajñaṃ tanvānā uśijo na manma |
Translation: 2 He, like the Sun, hath shone while Morn is breaking, and priests who weave the sacrifice sing praises,

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्जन्मानि देव आ वि विद्वान दरवद दूतो देवयावा वनिष्ठः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirjanmāni deva ā vi vidvān dravad dūto devayāvā vaniṣṭhaḥ ||
Translation: Agni, the God, who knows their generations and visits Gods, most bounteous, rapid envoy.

Sanskit Text: अछा गिरो मतयो देवयन्तीरग्निं यन्ति दरविणं भिक्षमाणाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā ghiro matayo devayantīraghniṃ yanti draviṇaṃ bhikṣamāṇāḥ |
Translation: 3 Our songs and holy hymns go forth to Agni, seeking the God and asking him for riches,

Sanskit Text: सुसन्द्र्शं सुप्रतीकं सवञ्चं हव्यवाहमरतिम्मानुषाणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: susandṛśaṃ supratīkaṃ svañcaṃ havyavāhamaratimmānuṣāṇām ||
Translation: Him fair to see, of goodly aspect, mighty, men's messenger who carries their oblations.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं नो अग्ने वसुभिः सजोषा रुद्रं रुद्रेभिरा वहा बर्हन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ no aghne vasubhiḥ sajoṣā rudraṃ rudrebhirā vahā bṛhantam |
Translation: 4 joined with the Vasus, Agni, bring thou Indra bring hither mighty Rudra with the Rudras,

Sanskit Text: आदित्येभिरदितिं विश्वजन्यां बर्हस्पतिं रक्वभिर्विश्ववारम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityebhiraditiṃ viśvajanyāṃ bṛhaspatiṃ ṛkvabhirviśvavāram ||
Translation: Aditi good to all men with Ādityas, Bṛhaspati All-bounteous, with the Singers.

Sanskit Text: मन्द्रं होतारमुशिजो यविष्ठमग्निं विश ईळते अध्वरेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mandraṃ hotāramuśijo yaviṣṭhamaghniṃ viśa īḷate adhvareṣu |
Translation: 5 Men eagerly implore at sacrifices Agni, Most Youthful God, the joyous Herald.

Sanskit Text: स हि कषपावानभवद रयीणामतन्द्रो दूतो यजथाय देवान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi kṣapāvānabhavad rayīṇāmatandro dūto yajathāya devān ||
Translation: For he is Lord and Ruler over riches, and for Gods’ worship an unwearied envoy.

Sanskit Text: महानस्यध्वरस्य परकेतो न रते तवदम्र्ता मादयन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahānasyadhvarasya praketo na ṛte tvadamṛtā mādayante |
Translation: 1. GREAT art thou, Agni, sacrifice's Herald: not without thee are deathless Gods made joyful.

Sanskit Text: आ विश्वेभिः सरथं याहि देवैर्न्यग्ने होता परथमः सदेह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā viśvebhiḥ sarathaṃ yāhi devairnyaghne hotā prathamaḥ sadeha ||
Translation: Come hither with all Deities about thee here take thy seat, the first, as Priest, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: तवामीळते अजिरं दूत्याय हविष्मन्तः सदमिन मानुषासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmīḷate ajiraṃ dūtyāya haviṣmantaḥ sadamin mānuṣāsaḥ |
Translation: 2 Men with oblations evermore entreat thee, the swift, to undertake an envoy's duty.

Sanskit Text: यस्य देवैरासदो बर्हिरग्ने.अहान्यस्मै सुदिना भवन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya devairāsado barhiraghne.ahānyasmai sudinā bhavanti ||
Translation: He on whose sacred grass with Gods thou sittest, to him, O Agni, are the days propitious.

Sanskit Text: तरिश्चिदक्तोः पर चिकितुर्वसूनि तवे अन्तर्दाशुषे मर्त्याय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: triścidaktoḥ pra cikiturvasūni tve antardāśuṣe martyāya |
Translation: 3 Three times a day in thee are shown the treasures sent for the mortal who presents oblation.

Sanskit Text: मनुष्वदग्न इह यक्षि देवान भवा नो दूतो अधिशस्तिपावा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manuṣvadaghna iha yakṣi devān bhavā no dūto adhiśastipāvā ||
Translation: Bring the Gods hither like a man, O Agni: be thou our envoy, guarding us from curses.

Sanskit Text: अग्निरीशे बर्हतो अध्वरस्याग्निर्विश्वस्य हविषः कर्तस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirīśe bṛhato adhvarasyāghnirviśvasya haviṣaḥ kṛtasya |
Translation: 4 Lord of the lofty sacrifice is Agni, Agni is Lord of every gift presented.

Sanskit Text: करतुं हयस्य वसवो जुषन्ताथा देवा दधिरे हव्यवाहम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratuṃ hyasya vasavo juṣantāthā devā dadhire havyavāham ||
Translation: The Vasus were contented with his wisdom, so the Gods made him their oblationbearer.

Sanskit Text: आग्ने वह हविरद्याय देवानिन्द्रज्येष्ठास इह मादयन्ताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āghne vaha haviradyāya devānindrajyeṣṭhāsa iha mādayantām |
Translation: 5 O Agni, bring the Gods to taste our presents: with Indra leading, here let them be joyful.

Sanskit Text: इमं यज्ञं दिवि देवेषु धेहि यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ yajñaṃ divi deveṣu dhehi yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Convey this sacrifice to Gods in heaven. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

Sanskit Text: अगन्म महा नमसा यविष्ठं यो दीदाय समिद्धः सवे दुरोणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghanma mahā namasā yaviṣṭhaṃ yo dīdāya samiddhaḥ sve duroṇe |
Translation: 1. WE with great reverence have approached The Youngest who hath shone forth well-kindled in his dwelling,

Sanskit Text: चित्रभानुं रोदसी अन्तरुर्वी सवाहुतं विश्वतः परत्यञ्चम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: citrabhānuṃ rodasī antarurvī svāhutaṃ viśvataḥ pratyañcam ||
Translation: With wondrous light between wide earth and heaven, well-worshipped, looking forth in all directions.

Sanskit Text: स मह्ना विश्वा दुरितानि साह्वानग्निः षटवे दम आ जातवेदाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa mahnā viśvā duritāni sāhvānaghniḥ ṣṭave dama ā jātavedāḥ |
Translation: 2 Through his great might o’ercoming all misfortunes, praised in the house is Agni Jātavedas.

Sanskit Text: स नो रक्षिषद दुरितादवद्यादस्मान गर्णत उत नो मघोनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no rakṣiṣad duritādavadyādasmān ghṛṇata uta no maghonaḥ ||
Translation: May he protect us from disgrace and trouble, both us who laud him and our noble patrons.

Sanskit Text: तवं वरुण उत मित्रो अग्ने तवां वर्धन्ति मतिभिर्वसिष्ठाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ varuṇa uta mitro aghne tvāṃ vardhanti matibhirvasiṣṭhāḥ |
Translation: 3 O Agni, thou art Varuṇa and Mitra: Vasisthas with their holy hymns exalt thee.

Sanskit Text: तवे वसु सुषणनानि सन्तु यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve vasu suṣaṇanāni santu yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: With thee be most abundant gain of treasure. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

Sanskit Text: पराग्नये विश्वशुचे धियन्धे.असुरघ्ने मन्म धीतिं भरध्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāghnaye viśvaśuce dhiyandhe.asuraghne manma dhītiṃ bharadhvam |
Translation: 1. BRING song and hymn to Agni, Asura-slayer, enlightener of all and thought-bestower.

Sanskit Text: भरे हविर्न बर्हिषि परीणानो वैश्वानराय यतये मतीनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhare havirna barhiṣi prīṇāno vaiśvānarāya yataye matīnām ||
Translation: Like an oblation on the grass, to please him, I bring this to Vaiśvānara, hymn-inspirer.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने शोचिषा शोशुचान आ रोदसी अप्र्णा जायमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne śociṣā śośucāna ā rodasī apṛṇā jāyamānaḥ |
Translation: 2 Thou with thy flame, O Agni, brightly glowing, hast at thy birth filled full the earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: तवं देवानभिशस्तेरमुञ्चो वैस्वानर जातवेदो महित्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ devānabhiśasteramuñco vaisvānara jātavedo mahitvā ||
Translation: TIOU with thy might, Vaiśvānara Jātavedas, settest the Gods free frodi the curse that bound them.

Sanskit Text: जातो यदग्ने भुवना वयख्यः पशून न गोपा इर्यः परिज्मा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jāto yadaghne bhuvanā vyakhyaḥ paśūn na ghopā iryaḥ parijmā |
Translation: 3 Agni, when, born thou lookedst on all creatures, like a brisk herdsman moving round his cattle.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानर बरह्मणे विन्द गातुं यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānara brahmaṇe vinda ghātuṃ yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: The path to prayer, Vaiśvānara, thou foundest. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

Sanskit Text: समिधा जातवेदसे देवाय देवहूतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samidhā jātavedase devāya devahūtibhiḥ |
Translation: 1. WITH reverence and with offered gifts serve we the God whose flame is bright:

Sanskit Text: हविर्भिः शुक्रशोचिषे नमस्विनो वयं दाशेमाग्नये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: havirbhiḥ śukraśociṣe namasvino vayaṃ dāśemāghnaye ||
Translation: Let us bring Jātavedas fuel, and adore Agni when we invoke the Gods.

Sanskit Text: वयं ते अग्ने समिधा विधेम वयं दाशेम सुष्टुती यजत्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ te aghne samidhā vidhema vayaṃ dāśema suṣṭutī yajatra |
Translation: 2 Agni, may we perform thy rites with fuel, and honour thee, O Holy one, with praises:

Sanskit Text: वयं घर्तेनाध्वरस्य होतर्वयं देव हविषा भद्रशोचे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ ghṛtenādhvarasya hotarvayaṃ deva haviṣā bhadraśoce ||
Translation: Honour thee, Priest of sacrifice! with butter, thee, God of blessed light! with our oblation.

Sanskit Text: आ नो देवेभिरुप देवहूतिमग्ने याहि वषट्क्र्तिं जुषाणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no devebhirupa devahūtimaghne yāhi vaṣaṭkṛtiṃ juṣāṇaḥ |
Translation: 3 Come, Agni, with the Gods to our invoking, come, pleased, to offerings sanctified with Vaṣaṭ.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्यं देवाय दाशतः सयाम यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyaṃ devāya dāśataḥ syāma yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: May we be his who pays thee, God, due honour. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

Sanskit Text: उपसद्याय मीळ्हुष आस्ये जुहुता हविः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upasadyāya mīḷhuṣa āsye juhutā haviḥ |
Translation: 1. OFFER oblations in his mouth, the bounteous God's whom we must serve.

Sanskit Text: यो नो नेदिष्ठमाप्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo no nediṣṭhamāpyam ||
Translation: His who is nearest kin to us:

Sanskit Text: यः पञ्च चर्षणीरभि निषसाद दमे-दमे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ pañca carṣaṇīrabhi niṣasāda dame-dame |
Translation: 2 Who for the Fivefold People's take hath seated him in every home

Sanskit Text: कविर्ग्र्हपतिर्युवा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kavirghṛhapatiryuvā ||
Translation: Wise, Youthful, Master of the house.

Sanskit Text: स नो वेदो अमात्यमग्नी रक्षतु विश्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no vedo amātyamaghnī rakṣatu viśvataḥ |
Translation: 3 On all sides may that Agni guard our household folk and property;

Sanskit Text: उतास्मान पात्वंहसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utāsmān pātvaṃhasaḥ ||
Translation: May he deliver us from woe.

Sanskit Text: नवं नु सतोममग्नये दिवः शयेनाय जीजनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: navaṃ nu stomamaghnaye divaḥ śyenāya jījanam |
Translation: 4 I have begotten this new hymn for Agni, Falcon of the sky:

Sanskit Text: वस्वः कुविद वनाति नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasvaḥ kuvid vanāti naḥ ||
Translation: Will he not give us of his wealth?

Sanskit Text: सपार्हा यस्य शरियो दर्शे रयिर्वीरवतो यथा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: spārhā yasya śriyo dṛśe rayirvīravato yathā |
Translation: 5 Whose lories when he glows in front of sacrite are fair to see,

Sanskit Text: अग्रे यज्ञस्य शोचतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghre yajñasya śocataḥ ||
Translation: Like wealth of one with hero sons.

Sanskit Text: सेमां वेतु वषट्क्र्तिमग्निर्जुषत नो गिरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: semāṃ vetu vaṣaṭkṛtimaghnirjuṣata no ghiraḥ |
Translation: 6 May he enjoy this hallowed gift, Agni accept our songs, who bears

Sanskit Text: यजिष्ठो हव्यवाहनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajiṣṭho havyavāhanaḥ ||
Translation: Oblations, best of worshippers.

Sanskit Text: नि तवा नक्ष्य विश्पते दयुमन्तं देव धीमहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni tvā nakṣya viśpate dyumantaṃ deva dhīmahi |
Translation: 7 Lord of the house, whom men must seek, we set thee down, O Worshipped Onel

Sanskit Text: सुवीरमग्न आहुत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvīramaghna āhuta ||
Translation: Bright, rich in heroes, Agni! God

Sanskit Text: कषप उस्रश्च दीदिहि सवग्नयस्त्वया वयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣapa usraśca dīdihi svaghnayastvayā vayam |
Translation: 8 Shine forth at night and morn: through thee with fires are we provided well.

Sanskit Text: सुवीरस्त्वमस्मयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvīrastvamasmayuḥ ||
Translation: Thou, rich in heroes, art our Friend.

Sanskit Text: उप तवा सातये नरो विप्रासो यन्ति धीतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa tvā sātaye naro viprāso yanti dhītibhiḥ |
Translation: 9 The men come near thee for their gain, the singers with their songs of praise:

Sanskit Text: उपाक्षरासहस्रिणी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upākṣarāsahasriṇī ||
Translation: Speech, thousandfold, comes near to thee.

Sanskit Text: अग्नी रक्षांसि सेधति शुक्रशोचिरमर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnī rakṣāṃsi sedhati śukraśociramartyaḥ |
Translation: 10 Bright, Purifier, meet for praise, Immortal with refulgent glow,

Sanskit Text: शुचिः पावक ईड्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuciḥ pāvaka īḍyaḥ ||
Translation: Agni drives Rākṣasas away.

Sanskit Text: स नो राधांस्या भरेशानः सहसो यहो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no rādhāṃsyā bhareśānaḥ sahaso yaho |
Translation: 11 As such, bring us abundant wealth, young Child of Strength, for this thou canst

Sanskit Text: भगश्च दातुवार्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhaghaśca dātuvāryam ||
Translation: May Bhaga give us what is choice.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने वीरवद यशो देवश्च सविता भगः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne vīravad yaśo devaśca savitā bhaghaḥ |
Translation: 12 Thou, Agni, givest hero fame: Bhaga and Savitar the God,

Sanskit Text: दितिश्चदाति वार्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ditiścadāti vāryam ||
Translation: And Did give us what is good.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने रक्षा णो अंहसः परति षम देव रीषतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne rakṣā ṇo aṃhasaḥ prati ṣma deva rīṣataḥ |
Translation: 13 Agni, preserve us from distress: consume our enemies, O God,

Sanskit Text: तपिष्ठैरजरो दह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tapiṣṭhairajaro daha ||
Translation: Eternal, with the hottest flames.

Sanskit Text: अधा मही न आयस्यनाध्र्ष्टो नर्पीतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā mahī na āyasyanādhṛṣṭo nṛpītaye |
Translation: 14 And, irresistible, be thou a mighty iron fort to us,

Sanskit Text: पूर्भवा शतभुजिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrbhavā śatabhujiḥ ||
Translation: With hundred walls for man's defence.

Sanskit Text: तवं नः पाह्यंहसो दोषावस्तरघायतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ pāhyaṃhaso doṣāvastaraghāyataḥ |
Translation: 15 Do thou preserve us, eve and morn, from sorrow, from the wicked men,

Sanskit Text: दिवा नक्तमदाभ्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divā naktamadābhya ||
Translation: Infallible! by day and night.

Sanskit Text: एना वो अग्निं नमसोर्जो नपातमा हुवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: enā vo aghniṃ namasorjo napātamā huve |
Translation: 1. WITH this my reverent hymn I call Agni for you, the Son of Strength,

Sanskit Text: परियं चेतिष्ठमरतिं सवध्वरं विश्वस्य दूतमम्र्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyaṃ cetiṣṭhamaratiṃ svadhvaraṃ viśvasya dūtamamṛtam ||
Translation: Dear, wisest envoy, served with noble sacrifice, immortal messenger of all.

Sanskit Text: स योजते अरुषा विश्वभोजसा स दुद्रवत सवाहुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa yojate aruṣā viśvabhojasā sa dudravat svāhutaḥ |
Translation: 2 His two red horses, all-supporting, let him yoke: let him, well-worshipped, urge them fast.

Sanskit Text: सुब्रह्मा यज्ञः सुशमी वसूनां देवं राधो जनानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: subrahmā yajñaḥ suśamī vasūnāṃ devaṃ rādho janānām ||
Translation: Then hath the sacrifice good prayers and happy end, and heavenly gift of wealth to men.

Sanskit Text: उदस्य शोचिरस्थादाजुह्वानस्य मीळ्हुषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udasya śocirasthādājuhvānasya mīḷhuṣaḥ |
Translation: 3 The flame of him the Bountiful, the Much-invoked, hath mounted up,

Sanskit Text: उद धूमासोरुषासो दिविस्प्र्शः समग्निमिन्धते नरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud dhūmāsoaruṣāso divispṛśaḥ samaghnimindhate naraḥ ||
Translation: And his red-coloured smoke-clouds reach and touch the sky: the men are kindling Agni well.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा दूतं कर्ण्महे यशस्तमं देवाना वीतये वह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā dūtaṃ kṛṇmahe yaśastamaṃ devānā vītaye vaha |
Translation: 4 Thee, thee Most Glorious One we make our messenger. Bring the Gods hither to the feast.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा सूनो सहसो मर्तभोजना रास्व तद यत तवेमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā sūno sahaso martabhojanā rāsva tad yat tvemahe ||
Translation: Give us, O Son of Strength, all food that fcedeth man: give that for which we pray to thee.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने गर्हपतिस्त्वं होता नो अध्वरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne ghṛhapatistvaṃ hotā no adhvare |
Translation: 5 Thou, Agni, art the homestead's Lord, our Herald at the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: तवं पोता विश्ववार परचेता यक्षि वेषि च वार्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ potā viśvavāra pracetā yakṣi veṣi ca vāryam ||
Translation: Lord of all boons, thou art the Cleanser and a Sage. Pay worship, and enjoy the good.

Sanskit Text: कर्धि रत्नं यजमानाय सुक्रतो तवं हि रत्नधा असि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛdhi ratnaṃ yajamānāya sukrato tvaṃ hi ratnadhā asi |
Translation: 6 Give riches to the sacrificer, O Most Wise, for thou art he who granteth wealth.

Sanskit Text: आन रते शिशीहि विश्वं रत्विजं सुशंसो यश्च दक्षते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āna ṛte śiśīhi viśvaṃ ṛtvijaṃ suśaṃso yaśca dakṣate ||
Translation: Inspire with zeal each priest at this our solemn rite; all who are skilled in singing praise.

Sanskit Text: तवे अग्ने सवाहुत परियासः सन्तु सूरयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve aghne svāhuta priyāsaḥ santu sūrayaḥ |
Translation: 7 O Agni who art worshipped well, dear let our princes he to thee,

Sanskit Text: यन्तारो ये मघवानो जनानामूर्वान दयन्त गोनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yantāro ye maghavāno janānāmūrvān dayanta ghonām ||
Translation: Our wealthy patrons who are governors of men, who part, as gifts, their stalls of kine.

Sanskit Text: येषामिळा घर्तहस्ता दुरोण आनपि पराता निषीदति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yeṣāmiḷā ghṛtahastā duroṇa ānapi prātā niṣīdati |
Translation: 8 They in whose home, her hand bearing the sacred oil, Iḷā sits down well-satisfied-

Sanskit Text: तांस्त्रायस्व सहस्य दरुहो निदो यछा नः शर्म दीर्घश्रुत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāṃstrāyasva sahasya druho nido yachā naḥ śarma dīrghaśrut ||
Translation: Guard them, Victorious God, from slander and from harm. give us a refuge famed afar.

Sanskit Text: स मन्द्रया च जिह्वया वह्निरासा विदुष्टरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa mandrayā ca jihvayā vahnirāsā viduṣṭaraḥ |
Translation: 9 Do thou, a Priest with pleasant tongue, most wise, and very near to us,

Sanskit Text: अग्ने रयिं मघवद्भ्यो न आ वह हव्यदातिं च सूदय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne rayiṃ maghavadbhyo na ā vaha havyadātiṃ ca sūdaya ||
Translation: Agni, bring riches hither to our liberal chiefs, and speed the oflering of our gifts.

Sanskit Text: ये राधांसि ददत्यश्व्या मघा कामेन शरवसो महः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye rādhāṃsi dadatyaśvyā maghā kāmena śravaso mahaḥ |
Translation: 10 They who bestow as bounty plenteous wealth of steeds, moved by desire of great renown-

Sanskit Text: तानंहसः पिप्र्हि पर्त्र्भिष टवं शतं पूर्भिर्यविष्ठ्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tānaṃhasaḥ pipṛhi partṛbhiṣ ṭvaṃ śataṃ pūrbhiryaviṣṭhya ||
Translation: Do thou with saving help preserve them from distress, Most Youthful! with a hundred forts.

Sanskit Text: देवो वो दरविणोदाः पूर्णां विवष्ट्यासिचम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devo vo draviṇodāḥ pūrṇāṃ vivaṣṭyāsicam |
Translation: 11 The God who gives your wealth demands a full libation poured to him.

Sanskit Text: उद वा सिञ्चध्वमुप वा पर्णध्वमादिद वो देव ओहते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud vā siñcadhvamupa vā pṛṇadhvamādid vo deva ohate ||
Translation: Pour ye it forth, then fill the vessel full again: then doth the God pay heed to you.

Sanskit Text: तं होतारमध्वरस्य परचेतसं वह्निं देवा अक्र्ण्वत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ hotāramadhvarasya pracetasaṃ vahniṃ devā akṛṇvata |
Translation: 12 Him have the Gods appointed Priest of sacrifice, oblation-bearer, passing wise.

Sanskit Text: दधाति रत्नं विधते सुवीर्यमग्निर्जनाय दाशुषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhāti ratnaṃ vidhate suvīryamaghnirjanāya dāśuṣe ||
Translation: Agni gives wealth and valour to the worshipper, to folk who offer up their gifts.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने भव सुषमिधा समिद्ध उत बर्हिरुर्विया वि सत्र्णीताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne bhava suṣamidhā samiddha uta barhirurviyā vi stṛṇītām ||
Translation: 1. AGNI, be kindled well with proper fuel, and let the grass be scattered wide about thee.

Sanskit Text: उत दवार उशतीर्वि शरयन्तामुत देवानुशत आ वहेह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta dvāra uśatīrvi śrayantāmuta devānuśata ā vaheha ||
Translation: 2 Let the impatient Portals be thrown open bring thou the Gods impatient to come hither.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने वीहि हविषा वक्षि देवान सवध्वरा कर्णुहि जातवेदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne vīhi haviṣā vakṣi devān svadhvarā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ ||
Translation: 3 Taste, Agni: serve the Gods with our oblation. Offer good sacrifices, Jātavedas!

Sanskit Text: सवध्वरा करति जातवेदा यक्षद देवानम्र्तान पिप्रयच्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svadhvarā karati jātavedā yakṣad devānamṛtān piprayacca ||
Translation: 4 Let Jātavedas pay fair sacrifices, worship andgratify the Gods Immortal.

Sanskit Text: वंस्व विश्वा वार्याणि परचेतः सत्या भवन्त्वाशिषो नोद्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaṃsva viśvā vāryāṇi pracetaḥ satyā bhavantvāśiṣo noadya ||
Translation: 5 Wise God, win for us things that are all-goodly, and let the prayers, we pray today be fruitful.

Sanskit Text: तवामु ते दधिरे हव्यवाहं देवासो अग्न ऊर्ज आ नपातम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmu te dadhire havyavāhaṃ devāso aghna ūrja ā napātam ||
Translation: 6 Thee, even thee, the Son of Strength, O Agni, those Gods have made the bearer of oblations.

Sanskit Text: ते ते देवाय दाशतः सयाम महो नो रत्ना वि दध इयानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te te devāya dāśataḥ syāma maho no ratnā vi dadha iyānaḥ ||
Translation: 7 To thee the God may we perform our worship: do thou, besought, grant us abundant riches.

Sanskit Text: तवे ह यत पितरश्चिन न इन्द्र विश्वा वामा जरितारो असन्वन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve ha yat pitaraścin na indra viśvā vāmā jaritāro asanvan |
Translation: 1. ALL is with thee, O Indra, all the treasures which erst our fathers won who sang thy praises.

Sanskit Text: तवे गावः सुदुघास्त्वे हयश्वास्त्वं वसु देवयतेवनिष्ठः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve ghāvaḥ sudughāstve hyaśvāstvaṃ vasu devayatevaniṣṭhaḥ ||
Translation: With thee are milch-kine good to milk, and horses: best winner thou of riches for the pious.

Sanskit Text: राजेव हि जनिभिः कषेष्येवाव दयुभिरभि विदुष कविः सन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājeva hi janibhiḥ kṣeṣyevāva dyubhirabhi viduṣ kaviḥ san |
Translation: 2 For like a King among his wives thou dwellest: with glories, as a Sage, surround and help us.

Sanskit Text: पिशा गिरो मघवन गोभिरश्वैस्त्वायतः शिशीहिराये अस्मान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: piśā ghiro maghavan ghobhiraśvaistvāyataḥ śiśīhirāye asmān ||
Translation: Make us, thy servants, strong for wealth, and honour our songs wirth kine and steeds and decoration.

Sanskit Text: इमा उ तवा पस्प्र्धानासो अत्र मन्द्रा गिरो देवयन्तीरुप सथुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā u tvā paspṛdhānāso atra mandrā ghiro devayantīrupa sthuḥ |
Translation: 3 Here these our holy hymns with joy and gladness in pious emulation have approached thee.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाची ते पथ्या राय एतु सयाम ते सुमताविन्द्र शर्मन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvācī te pathyā rāya etu syāma te sumatāvindra śarman ||
Translation: Hitherward come thy path that leads to riches: may we find shelter in thy favour, Indra.

Sanskit Text: धेनुं न तवा सूयवसे दुदुक्षन्नुप बरह्माणि सस्र्जे वसिष्ठः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhenuṃ na tvā sūyavase dudukṣannupa brahmāṇi sasṛje vasiṣṭhaḥ |
Translation: 4 Vasiṣṭha hath poured forth his prayers, desiring to milk thee like a cow in goodly pasture.

Sanskit Text: तवामिन मे गोपतिं विश्व आहा न इन्द्रः सुमतिं गन्त्वछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmin me ghopatiṃ viśva āhā na indraḥ sumatiṃ ghantvacha ||
Translation: All these my people call thee Lord of cattle: may Indra. come unto the prayer we offer.

Sanskit Text: अर्णांसि चित पप्रथाना सुदास इन्द्रो गाधान्यक्र्णोत सुपारा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arṇāṃsi cit paprathānā sudāsa indro ghādhānyakṛṇot supārā |
Translation: 5 What though the floods spread widely, Indra made them shallow and easy for Sudās to traverse.

Sanskit Text: शर्धन्तं शिम्युमुचथस्य नव्यः शापं सिन्धूनामक्र्णोदशस्तीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śardhantaṃ śimyumucathasya navyaḥ śāpaṃ sindhūnāmakṛṇodaśastīḥ ||
Translation: He, worthy of our praises, caused the Simyu, foe of our hymn, to curse the rivers' fury.

Sanskit Text: पुरोळा इत तुर्वशो यक्षुरासीद राये मत्स्यासो निशिता अपीव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: puroḷā it turvaśo yakṣurāsīd rāye matsyāso niśitā apīva |
Translation: 6 Eager for spoil was Turvaśa Purodas, fain to win wealth, like fishes urged by hunger.

Sanskit Text: शरुष्टिं चक्रुर्भ्र्गवो दरुह्यवश्च सखा सखायमतरद विषूचोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śruṣṭiṃ cakrurbhṛghavo druhyavaśca sakhā sakhāyamatarad viṣūcoḥ ||
Translation: The Bhṛgus and the Druhyus quickly listened: friend rescued friend mid the two distant peoples.

Sanskit Text: आ पक्थासो भलानसो भनन्तालिनासो विषाणिनः शिवासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā pakthāso bhalānaso bhanantālināso viṣāṇinaḥ śivāsaḥ |
Translation: 7 Together came the Pakthas, the Bhalanas, the Alinas, the Sivas, the Visanins.

Sanskit Text: आ यो.अनयत सधमा आर्यस्य गव्या तर्त्सुभ्यो अजगन युधा नर्न ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yo.anayat sadhamā āryasya ghavyā tṛtsubhyo ajaghan yudhā nṛn ||
Translation: Yet to the Trtsus came the Ārya's Comrade, through love of spoil and heroes' war, to lead them.

Sanskit Text: दुराध्यो अदितिं सरेवयन्तो.अचेतसो वि जग्र्भ्रे परुष्णीम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: durādhyo aditiṃ srevayanto.acetaso vi jaghṛbhre paruṣṇīm |
Translation: 8 Fools, in their folly fain to waste her waters, they parted inexhaustible Paruṣṇī.

Sanskit Text: मह्नाविव्यक पर्थिवीं पत्यमानः पशुष कविरशयच्चायमानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahnāvivyak pṛthivīṃ patyamānaḥ paśuṣ kaviraśayaccāyamānaḥ ||
Translation: Lord of the Earth, he with his might repressed them: still lay the herd and the affrighted herdsman.

Sanskit Text: ईयुरर्थं न नयर्थं परुष्णीमाशुश्चनेदभिपित्वं जगाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īyurarthaṃ na nyarthaṃ paruṣṇīmāśuścanedabhipitvaṃ jaghāma |
Translation: 9 As to their goal they sped to their destruetion: they sought Paruṣṇī; e’en the swift returned not.

Sanskit Text: सुदास इन्द्रः सुतुकानमित्रानरन्धयन मानुषे वध्रिवाचः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sudāsa indraḥ sutukānamitrānarandhayan mānuṣe vadhrivācaḥ ||
Translation: Indra abandoned, to Sudās the manly, the swiftly flying foes, unmanly babblers.

Sanskit Text: ईयुर्गावो न यवसादगोपा यथाक्र्तमभि मित्रं चितासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īyurghāvo na yavasādaghopā yathākṛtamabhi mitraṃ citāsaḥ |
Translation: 10 They went like kine unherded from the pasture, each clinging to a friend as chance directed.

Sanskit Text: पर्श्निगावः पर्श्निनिप्रेषितासः शरुष्टिं चक्रुर्नियुतो रन्तयश्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛśnighāvaḥ pṛśninipreṣitāsaḥ śruṣṭiṃ cakrurniyuto rantayaśca ||
Translation: They who drive spotted steeds, sent down by Pṛśni, gave ear, the Warriors and the harnessed horses.

Sanskit Text: एकं च यो विंशतिं च शरवस्या वैकर्णयोर्जनान राजा नयस्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ekaṃ ca yo viṃśatiṃ ca śravasyā vaikarṇayorjanān rājā nyastaḥ |
Translation: 11 The King who scattered one-and-twenty people of both Vaikarna tribes through lust of glory-

Sanskit Text: दस्मो न सद्मन नि शिशाति बर्हिः शूरः सर्गमक्र्णोदिन्द्र एषाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dasmo na sadman ni śiśāti barhiḥ śūraḥ sarghamakṛṇodindra eṣām ||
Translation: As the skilled priest clips grass within the chamber, so hath the Hero Indra, wrought their downfall.

Sanskit Text: अध शरुतं कवषं वर्द्धमप्स्वनु दरुह्युं नि वर्णग वज्रबाहुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha śrutaṃ kavaṣaṃ vṛddhamapsvanu druhyuṃ ni vṛṇagh vajrabāhuḥ |
Translation: 12 Thou, thunder-armed, o’erwhelmedst in the waters famed ancient Kavasa and then the Druhyu.

Sanskit Text: वर्णाना अत्र सख्याय सख्यं तवायन्तो ये अमदन्ननु तवा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṇānā atra sakhyāya sakhyaṃ tvāyanto ye amadannanu tvā ||
Translation: Others here claiming friendship to their friendship, devoted unto thee, in thee were joyful.

Sanskit Text: वि सद्यो विश्वा दरंहितान्येषामिन्द्रः पुरः सहसा सप्त दर्दः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi sadyo viśvā dṛṃhitānyeṣāmindraḥ puraḥ sahasā sapta dardaḥ |
Translation: 13 Indra at once with conquering might demolished all their strong places and their seven castles.

Sanskit Text: वयानवस्य तर्त्सवे गयं भाग जेष्म पूरुं विदथे मर्ध्रवाचम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyānavasya tṛtsave ghayaṃ bhāgh jeṣma pūruṃ vidathe mṛdhravācam ||
Translation: The goods of Anu's son he gave to Trtsu. May we in sacrifice conquer scorned Pūru.

Sanskit Text: नि गव्यवो.अनवो दरुह्यवश्च षष्टिः शता सुषुपुः षट सहस्रा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni ghavyavo.anavo druhyavaśca ṣaṣṭiḥ śatā suṣupuḥ ṣaṭ sahasrā |
Translation: 14 The Anavas and Druhyus, seeking booty, have slept, the sixty hundred, yea, six thousand,

Sanskit Text: षष्टिर्वीरासो अधि षड दुवोयु विश्वेदिन्द्रस्य वीर्या कर्तानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṣaṣṭirvīrāso adhi ṣaḍ duvoyu viśvedindrasya vīryā kṛtāni ||
Translation: And six-and-sixty heroes. For the pious were all these mighty exploits done by Indra.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रेणैते तर्त्सवो वेविषाणा आपो न सर्ष्टा अधवन्त नीचीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indreṇaite tṛtsavo veviṣāṇā āpo na sṛṣṭā adhavanta nīcīḥ |
Translation: 15 These Trtsus under Indra's careful guidance came speeding like loosed waters rushing downward.

Sanskit Text: दुर्मित्रासः परकलविन मिमाना जहुर्विश्वानि भोजना सुदासे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: durmitrāsaḥ prakalavin mimānā jahurviśvāni bhojanā sudāse ||
Translation: The foemen, measuring exceeding closely, abandoned to Sudās all their provisions.

Sanskit Text: अर्धं वीरस्य शर्तपामनिन्द्रं परा शर्धन्तं नुनुदे अभि कषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ardhaṃ vīrasya śṛtapāmanindraṃ parā śardhantaṃ nunude abhi kṣām |
Translation: 16 The hero's side who drank the dressed oblation, Indra's denier, far o’er earth he scattered.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो मन्युं मन्युम्यो मिमाय भेजे पथो वर्तनिम्पत्यमानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro manyuṃ manyumyo mimāya bheje patho vartanimpatyamānaḥ ||
Translation: Indra brought down the fierce destroyer's fury. He gave them various roads, the path's Controller.

Sanskit Text: आध्रेण चित तद वेकं चकार सिंह्यं चित पेत्वेना जघान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādhreṇa cit tad vekaṃ cakāra siṃhyaṃ cit petvenā jaghāna |
Translation: 17 E’en with the weak he wrought this matchless exploit: e’en with a goat he did to death a lion.

Sanskit Text: अव सरक्तीर्वेश्याव्र्श्चदिन्द्रः परायछद विश्वा भोजना सुदासे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava sraktīrveśyāvṛścadindraḥ prāyachad viśvā bhojanā sudāse ||
Translation: He pared the pillar's angles with a needle. Thus to Sudās Indra gave all provisions.

Sanskit Text: शश्वन्तो हि शत्रवो रारधुष टे भेदस्य चिच्छर्धतो विन्द रन्धिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaśvanto hi śatravo rāradhuṣ ṭe bhedasya cicchardhato vinda randhim |
Translation: 18 To thee have all thine enemies submitted: e’en the fierce Bheda hast thou made thy subject.

Sanskit Text: मर्तानेन सतुवतो यः कर्णोति तिग्मं तस्मिन नि जहि वज्रमिन्द्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: martānena stuvato yaḥ kṛṇoti tighmaṃ tasmin ni jahi vajramindra ||
Translation: Cast down thy sharpened thunderbolt, O Indra, on him who harms the men who sing thy praises.

Sanskit Text: आवदिन्द्रं यमुना तर्त्सवश्च परात्र भेदं सर्वतातामुषायत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvadindraṃ yamunā tṛtsavaśca prātra bhedaṃ sarvatātāmuṣāyat |
Translation: 19 Yamuna and the Trtsus aided Indra. There he stripped Bheda bare of all his treasures.

Sanskit Text: अजासश्च शिग्रवो यक्षवश्च बलिं शीर्षाणि जभ्रुरश्व्यानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajāsaśca śighravo yakṣavaśca baliṃ śīrṣāṇi jabhruraśvyāni ||
Translation: The Ajas and the Sigrus and the Yaksus brought in to him as tribute heads of horses.

Sanskit Text: न त इन्द्र सुमतयो न रायः संचक्षे पूर्वा उषसो न नूत्नाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na ta indra sumatayo na rāyaḥ saṃcakṣe pūrvā uṣaso na nūtnāḥ |
Translation: 20 Not to be scorned, but like Dawns past and recent, O Indra, are thy favours and thy riches.

Sanskit Text: देवकं चिन मान्यमानं जघन्थाव तमना बर्हतः शम्बरं भेत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devakaṃ cin mānyamānaṃ jaghanthāva tmanā bṛhataḥ śambaraṃ bhet ||
Translation: Devaka, Mānyamana's son, thou slewest, and smotest Śambara from the lofty mountain.

Sanskit Text: पर ये गर्हादममदुस्त्वाया पराशरः शतयातुर्वसिष्ठः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ye ghṛhādamamadustvāyā parāśaraḥ śatayāturvasiṣṭhaḥ |
Translation: 21 They who, from home, have gladdened thee, thy servants Parasara, Vasiṣṭha, Satayatu,

Sanskit Text: न ते भोजस्य सख्यं मर्षन्ताधा सूरिभ्यः सुदिना वयुछान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na te bhojasya sakhyaṃ mṛṣantādhā sūribhyaḥ sudinā vyuchān ||
Translation: Will not forget thy friendship, liberal Giver. So shall the days dawn prosperous for the princes.

Sanskit Text: दवे नप्तुर्देववतः शते गोर्द्वा रथा वधूमन्ता सुदासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dve napturdevavataḥ śate ghordvā rathā vadhūmantā sudāsaḥ |
Translation: 22 Priest-like, with praise, I move around the altar, earning Paijavana's reward, O Agni,

Sanskit Text: अर्हन्नग्ने पैजवनस्य दानं होतेव सद्म पर्येमि रेभन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arhannaghne paijavanasya dānaṃ hoteva sadma paryemi rebhan ||
Translation: Two hundred cows from Devavan's descendant, two chariots from Sudās with mares to draw them.

Sanskit Text: चत्वारो मा पैजवनस्य दानाः समद्दिष्टयः कर्शनिनो निरेके |
Sanskrit Transliteration: catvāro mā paijavanasya dānāḥ smaddiṣṭayaḥ kṛśanino nireke |
Translation: 23 Gift of Paijavana, four horses bear me in foremost place, trained steeds with pearl to deck them.

Sanskit Text: रज्रासो मा पर्थिविष्ठाः सुदासस्तोकं तोकाय शरवसे वहन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛjrāso mā pṛthiviṣṭhāḥ sudāsastokaṃ tokāya śravase vahanti ||
Translation: Sudās's brown steeds, firmly-stepping, carry me and my son for progeny and glory.

Sanskit Text: यस्य शरवो रोदसी अन्तरुर्वी शीर्ष्णे-शीर्ष्णे विबभाजा विभक्ता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya śravo rodasī antarurvī śīrṣṇe-śīrṣṇe vibabhājā vibhaktā |
Translation: 24 Him whose fame spreads between wide earth and heaven, who, as dispenser, gives each chief his portion,

Sanskit Text: सप्तेदिन्द्रं न सरवतो गर्णन्ति नि युध्यामधिमशिशादभीके ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saptedindraṃ na sravato ghṛṇanti ni yudhyāmadhimaśiśādabhīke ||
Translation: Seven flowing Rivers glorify like Indra. He slew Yudhyamadhi in close encounter.

Sanskit Text: इमं नरो मरुतः सश्चतानु दिवोदासं न पितरं सुदासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ naro marutaḥ saścatānu divodāsaṃ na pitaraṃ sudāsaḥ |
Translation: 25 Attend on him O ye heroic Maruts as on Sudās's father Divodāsa.

Sanskit Text: अविष्टना पैजवनस्य केतं दूणाशं कषत्रमजरं दुवोयु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aviṣṭanā paijavanasya ketaṃ dūṇāśaṃ kṣatramajaraṃ duvoyu ||
Translation: Further Paijavana's desire with favour. Guard faithfully his lasting firm dominion.

Sanskit Text: यस्तिग्मश्र्ङगो वर्षभो न भीम एकः कर्ष्टीश्च्यावयति पर विश्वाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yastighmaśṛṅgho vṛṣabho na bhīma ekaḥ kṛṣṭīścyāvayati pra viśvāḥ |
Translation: 1. HE like a bull with sharpened horns, terrific, singly excites and agitates all the people:

Sanskit Text: यः शश्वतो अदाशुषो गयस्य परयन्तासिसुष्वितराय वेदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ śaśvato adāśuṣo ghayasya prayantāsisuṣvitarāya vedaḥ ||
Translation: Thou givest him who largely pours libations his goods who pours not, for his own possession.

Sanskit Text: तवं ह तयदिन्द्र कुत्समावः शुश्रूषमाणस्तन्वा समर्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ ha tyadindra kutsamāvaḥ śuśrūṣamāṇastanvā samarye |
Translation: 2 Thou, verily, Indra, gavest help to Kutsa, willingly giving car to him in battle,

Sanskit Text: दासं यच्छुष्णं कुयवं नयस्मा अरन्धय आर्जुनेयाय शिक्षन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dāsaṃ yacchuṣṇaṃ kuyavaṃ nyasmā arandhaya ārjuneyāya śikṣan ||
Translation: When, aiding Ārjuneya, thou subduedst to him both Kuyava and the Dāsa Śuṣṇa.

Sanskit Text: तवं धर्ष्णो धर्षता वीतहव्यं परावो विश्वाभिरूतिभिः सुदासम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā vītahavyaṃ prāvo viśvābhirūtibhiḥ sudāsam |
Translation: 3 O Bold One, thou with all thine aids hast boldly holpen Sudās whose offerings were accepted,

Sanskit Text: पर पौरुकुत्सिं तरसदस्युमावः कषेत्रसाता वर्त्रहत्येषु पूरुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra paurukutsiṃ trasadasyumāvaḥ kṣetrasātā vṛtrahatyeṣu pūrum ||
Translation: Pūru in winning land and slaying foemen, and Trasadasyu son of Purukutsa.

Sanskit Text: तवं नर्भिर्न्र्मणो देववीतौ भूरीणि वर्त्रा हर्यश्व हंसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ nṛbhirnṛmaṇo devavītau bhūrīṇi vṛtrā haryaśva haṃsi |
Translation: 4 At the Gods’ banquet, hero-souled! with Heroes, Lord of Bay Steeds, thou slewest many foemen.

Sanskit Text: तवं नि दस्युं चुमुरिं धुनिं चास्वापयो दभीतये सुहन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ ni dasyuṃ cumuriṃ dhuniṃ cāsvāpayo dabhītaye suhantu ||
Translation: Thou sentest in swift death to sleep the Dasyu, both Cumuri and Dhuni, for Dabhīti.

Sanskit Text: तव चयौत्नानि वज्रहस्त तानि नव यत पुरो नवतिं च सद्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava cyautnāni vajrahasta tāni nava yat puro navatiṃ ca sadyaḥ |
Translation: 5 These were thy mighty powers that, Thunder-wielder, thou swiftly crushedst nine-and-ninety castles:

Sanskit Text: निवेशने शततमाविवेषीरहञ्च वर्त्रं नमुचिमुताहन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niveśane śatatamāviveṣīrahañca vṛtraṃ namucimutāhan ||
Translation: Thou capturedst the hundredth in thine onslaught; thou slewest Namuci, thou slewest Vṛtra.

Sanskit Text: सना ता त इन्द्र भोजनानि रातहव्याय दाशुषे सुदासे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanā tā ta indra bhojanāni rātahavyāya dāśuṣe sudāse |
Translation: 6 Old are the blessings, Indra, which thou gavest Sudās the worshipper who brought oblations.

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्णे ते हरी वर्षणा युनज्मि वयन्तु बरह्माणि पुरुशाक वाजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṇe te harī vṛṣaṇā yunajmi vyantu brahmāṇi puruśāka vājam ||
Translation: For thee, the Strong, I yoke thy strong Bay Horses: may our prayers reach thee and win strength, Most Mighty!

Sanskit Text: मा ते अस्यां सहसावन परिष्टावघाय भूम हरिवः परादै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā te asyāṃ sahasāvan pariṣṭāvaghāya bhūma harivaḥ parādai |
Translation: 7 Give us not up, Lord of Bay Horses, Victor, in this thine own assembly, to the wicked.

Sanskit Text: तरायस्व नो.अव्र्केभिर्वरूथैस्तव परियासः सूरिषु सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trāyasva no.avṛkebhirvarūthaistava priyāsaḥ sūriṣu syāma ||
Translation: Deliver us with true and faithful succours: dear may we be to thee among the princes.

Sanskit Text: परियास इत ते मघवन्नभिष्टौ नरो मदेम शरणे सखायः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyāsa it te maghavannabhiṣṭau naro madema śaraṇe sakhāyaḥ |
Translation: 8 May we men, Maghavan, the friends thou lovest, near thee be joyful under thy protection.

Sanskit Text: नि तुर्वशं नि याद्वं शिशीह्यतिथिग्वाय शंस्यं करिष्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni turvaśaṃ ni yādvaṃ śiśīhyatithighvāya śaṃsyaṃ kariṣyan ||
Translation: Fain to fulfil the wish of Atithigva humble. the pride of Turvaśa and Yadva.

Sanskit Text: सद्यश्चिन नु ते मघवन्नभिष्टौ नरः शंसन्त्युक्थशास उक्था |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadyaścin nu te maghavannabhiṣṭau naraḥ śaṃsantyukthaśāsa ukthā |
Translation: 9 Swiftly, in truth, O Maghavan, about thee men skilled in hymning sing their songs and praises. '

Sanskit Text: ये ते हवेभिर्वि पणीन्रदाशन्नस्मान वर्णीष्व युज्याय तस्मै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye te havebhirvi paṇīnradāśannasmān vṛṇīṣva yujyāya tasmai ||
Translation: Elect us also into their assembly who by their calls on thee despoiled the niggards.

Sanskit Text: एते सतोमा नरां नर्तम तुभ्यमस्मद्र्यञ्चो ददतो मघानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete stomā narāṃ nṛtama tubhyamasmadryañco dadato maghāni |
Translation: 10 Thine are these lauds, O manliest of heroes, lauds which revert to us and give us riches.

Sanskit Text: तेषामिन्द्र वर्त्रहत्ये शिवो भूः सखा च शूरो.अविताच नर्णाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: teṣāmindra vṛtrahatye śivo bhūḥ sakhā ca śūro.avitāca nṛṇām ||
Translation: Favour these, Indra, when they fight with faemen, as Friend and Hero and the heroes' Helper.

Sanskit Text: नू इन्द्र शूर सतवमान ऊती बरह्मजूतस्तन्वा वाव्र्धस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū indra śūra stavamāna ūtī brahmajūtastanvā vāvṛdhasva |
Translation: 11 Now, lauded for thine aid, Heroic Indra, sped by our prayer, wax mighty in thy body.

Sanskit Text: उप नो वाजान मिमीह्युप सतीन यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa no vājān mimīhyupa stīn yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Apportion to us strength and habitations. Ye Gods, protect us evermore with blessings.

Sanskit Text: उग्रो जज्ञे वीर्याय सवधावाञ्चक्रिरपो नर्यो यत करिष्यन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughro jajñe vīryāya svadhāvāñcakrirapo naryo yat kariṣyan |
Translation: 1. STRONG, Godly-natured, born for hero exploit, man's Friend, hedoth whatever deed he willeth.

Sanskit Text: जग्मिर्युवा नर्षदनमवोभिस्त्राता न इन्द्र एनसो महश्चित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jaghmiryuvā nṛṣadanamavobhistrātā na indra enaso mahaścit ||
Translation: Saving us e’en from great transgression, Indra, the Youthful, visiteth man's home with favour.

Sanskit Text: हन्त वर्त्रमिन्द्रः शूशुवानः परावीन नु वीरो जरितारमूती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hanta vṛtramindraḥ śūśuvānaḥ prāvīn nu vīro jaritāramūtī |
Translation: 2 Waxing greatness Indra slayeth Vṛtra: the Hero with his aid hath helped the singer.

Sanskit Text: कर्ता सुदासे अह वा उ लोकं दाता वसु मुहुरा दाशुषे भूत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kartā sudāse aha vā u lokaṃ dātā vasu muhurā dāśuṣe bhūt ||
Translation: He gave Sudās wide room and space, and often hath granted wealth to him who brought oblations.

Sanskit Text: युध्मो अनर्वा खजक्र्त समद्वा शूरः सत्राषाड जनुषेमषाळ्हः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yudhmo anarvā khajakṛt samadvā śūraḥ satrāṣāḍ januṣemaṣāḷhaḥ |
Translation: 3 Soldier unchecked, war-rousing, battling Hero, unconquered from of old, victorious ever,

Sanskit Text: वयास इन्द्रः पर्तनाः सवोजा अधा विश्वंशत्रूयन्तं जघान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyāsa indraḥ pṛtanāḥ svojā adhā viśvaṃśatrūyantaṃ jaghāna ||
Translation: Indra the very strong hath scattered armies; yea, he hath slain each foe who fought against him.

Sanskit Text: उभे चिदिन्द्र रोदसी महित्वा पप्राथ तविषीभिस्तुविष्मः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhe cidindra rodasī mahitvā paprātha taviṣībhistuviṣmaḥ |
Translation: 4 Thou with thy greatness hast filled full, O Indra, even both the worlds with might, O thou Most Mighty.

Sanskit Text: नि वज्रमिन्द्रो हरिवान मिमिक्षन समन्धसा मदेषु वाुवोच ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni vajramindro harivān mimikṣan samandhasā madeṣu vāuvoca ||
Translation: Lord of Bays, Indra, brandishing his thunder, is gratified with Soma at the banquet.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा जजान वर्षणं रणाय तमु चिन नारी नर्यं ससूव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā jajāna vṛṣaṇaṃ raṇāya tamu cin nārī naryaṃ sasūva |
Translation: 5 A Bull begat the Bull for joy of battle, and a strong Mother brought forth him the manly.

Sanskit Text: पर यः सेनानीरध नर्भ्यो अस्तीनः सत्वा गवेषणः स धर्ष्णुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yaḥ senānīradha nṛbhyo astīnaḥ satvā ghaveṣaṇaḥ sa dhṛṣṇuḥ ||
Translation: He who is Chief of men, their armies' Leader, is strong Hero, bold, and fain for booty.

Sanskit Text: नू चित स भरेषते जनो न रेषन मनो यो अस्य घोरमाविवासात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū cit sa bhreṣate jano na reṣan mano yo asya ghoramāvivāsāt |
Translation: 6 The people falter not, nor suffer sorrow, who win themselves this God's terrific spirit.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञैर्य इन्द्रे दधते दुवांसि कषयत स राय रतपा रतेजाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñairya indre dadhate duvāṃsi kṣayat sa rāya ṛtapā ṛtejāḥ ||
Translation: He who with sacrifices worships Indra is lord of wealth, law-born and law's protector.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्र पूर्वो अपराय शिक्षन्नयज्ज्यायान कनीयसो देष्णम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindra pūrvo aparāya śikṣannayajjyāyān kanīyaso deṣṇam |
Translation: 7 Whene’er the elder fain would help the younger the greater cometh to the lesser's present.

Sanskit Text: अम्र्त इत पर्यासीत दूरमा चित्र चित्र्यं भरा रयिं नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: amṛta it paryāsīta dūramā citra citryaṃ bharā rayiṃ naḥ ||
Translation: Shall the Immortal sit aloof' inactive? O Wondrous Indra, bring us wondrous riches.

Sanskit Text: यस्त इन्द्र परियो जनो ददाशदसन निरेके अद्रिवः सखा ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasta indra priyo jano dadāśadasan nireke adrivaḥ sakhā te |
Translation: 8 Thy dear folk, Indra, who present oblations, are, in chief place, thy friends, O Thunder-wielder.

Sanskit Text: वयं ते अस्यां सुमतौ चनिष्ठाः सयाम वरूथे अघ्नतो नर्पीतौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ te asyāṃ sumatau caniṣṭhāḥ syāma varūthe aghnato nṛpītau ||
Translation: May we be best content in this thy favour, sheltered by One who slays not, but preserves us.

Sanskit Text: एष सतोमो अचिक्रदद वर्षा त उत सतामुर्मघवन्नक्रपिष्ट |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa stomo acikradad vṛṣā ta uta stāmurmaghavannakrapiṣṭa |
Translation: 9 To thee the mighty hymn hath clamoured loudly, and, Maghavan, the eloquent hath besought thee.

Sanskit Text: रायस कामो जरितारं त आगन तवमङग शक्र वस्व आशको नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyas kāmo jaritāraṃ ta āghan tvamaṅgha śakra vasva āśako naḥ ||
Translation: Desire of wealth hath come upon thy singer: help us then, gakra, to our share of riches.

Sanskit Text: स न इन्द्र तवयताया इषे धास्त्मना च ये मघवानो जुनन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa na indra tvayatāyā iṣe dhāstmanā ca ye maghavāno junanti |
Translation: 10 Place us by food which thou hast given, O Indra, us and the wealthy patrons who command us.

Sanskit Text: वस्वी षु ते जरित्रे अस्तु शक्तिर्यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasvī ṣu te jaritre astu śaktiryūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Let thy great power bring good to him who lauds thee. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

Sanskit Text: पिबा सोममिन्द्र मन्दतु तवा यं ते सुषाव हर्यश्वाद्रिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibā somamindra mandatu tvā yaṃ te suṣāva haryaśvādriḥ |
Translation: 1. DRINK Soma, Lord of Bays, and let it cheer thee: Indra, the stone, like a well guided courser,

Sanskit Text: सोतुर्बाहुभ्यां सुयतो नार्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: soturbāhubhyāṃ suyato nārvā ||
Translation: Directed by the presser's arms hath pressed it.

Sanskit Text: यस्ते मदो युज्यश्चारुरस्ति येन वर्त्राणि हर्यश्व हंसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaste mado yujyaścārurasti yena vṛtrāṇi haryaśva haṃsi |
Translation: 2 So let the draught of joy, thy dear companion, by which, O Lord of Bays, thou slayest foemen,

Sanskit Text: स तवामिन्द्र परभूवसो ममत्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvāmindra prabhūvaso mamattu ||
Translation: Delight thee, Indra, Lord of princely treasures.

Sanskit Text: बोधा सु मे मघवन वाचमेमां यां ते वसिष्ठो अर्चतिप्रशस्तिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bodhā su me maghavan vācamemāṃ yāṃ te vasiṣṭho arcatipraśastim |
Translation: 3 Mark closely, Maghavan, the words I utter, this eulogy recited by Vasiṣṭha:

Sanskit Text: इमा बरह्म सधमादे जुषस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā brahma sadhamāde juṣasva ||
Translation: Accept the prayers I offer at thy banquet.

Sanskit Text: शरुधी हवं विपिपानस्याद्रेर्बोधा विप्रस्यार्चतो मनीषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrudhī havaṃ vipipānasyādrerbodhā viprasyārcato manīṣām |
Translation: 4 Hear thou the call of the juice-drinking press-stone: hear thou the Brahman's hymn who sings and lauds thee.

Sanskit Text: कर्ष्वा दुवांस्यन्तमा सचेमा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṣvā duvāṃsyantamā sacemā ||
Translation: Take to thine inmost self these adorations.

Sanskit Text: न ते गिरो अपि मर्ष्ये तुरस्य न सुष्टुतिमसुर्यस्य विद्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na te ghiro api mṛṣye turasya na suṣṭutimasuryasya vidvān |
Translation: 5 I know and ne’er forget the hymns and praises of thee, the Conqueror, and thy strength immortal.

Sanskit Text: सदा ते नाम सवयशो विवक्मि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadā te nāma svayaśo vivakmi ||
Translation: Thy name I ever utter. Self-Refulgent

Sanskit Text: भूरि हि ते सवना मानुषेषु भूरि मनीषी हवते तवामित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūri hi te savanā mānuṣeṣu bhūri manīṣī havate tvāmit |
Translation: 6 Among mankind many are thy libations, and many a time the pious sageinvokes thee.

Sanskit Text: मारे अस्मन मघवञ जयोक कः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: māre asman maghavañ jyok kaḥ ||
Translation: O Maghavan, be not long distant from us.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्येदिमा सवना शूर विश्वा तुभ्यं बरह्माणि वर्धना कर्णोमि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyedimā savanā śūra viśvā tubhyaṃ brahmāṇi vardhanā kṛṇomi |
Translation: 7 All these libations are for thee, O Hero: to thee I offer these my prayers. that strengthen.

Sanskit Text: तवं नर्भिर्हव्यो विश्वधासि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ nṛbhirhavyo viśvadhāsi ||
Translation: Ever, in every place, must men invoke thee.

Sanskit Text: नू चिन नु ते मन्यमानस्य दस्मोदश्नुवन्ति महिमानमुग्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū cin nu te manyamānasya dasmodaśnuvanti mahimānamughra |
Translation: 8 Never do men attain, O Wonder-Worker, thy greatness, Mighty One, who must be lauded,

Sanskit Text: न वीर्यमिन्द्र ते न राधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na vīryamindra te na rādhaḥ ||
Translation: Nor, Indra, thine heroic power and bounty.

Sanskit Text: ये च पूर्व रषयो ये च नूत्ना इन्द्र बरह्माणि जनयन्त विप्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye ca pūrva ṛṣayo ye ca nūtnā indra brahmāṇi janayanta viprāḥ |
Translation: 9 Among all Ṛṣis, Indra, old and recent, who have engendered hymns as sacred singers,

Sanskit Text: अस्मे ते सन्तु सख्या शिवानि यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme te santu sakhyā śivāni yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Even with us be thine auspicious friendships. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

Sanskit Text: उदु बरह्माण्यैरत शरवस्येन्द्रं समर्ये महया वसिष्ठ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udu brahmāṇyairata śravasyendraṃ samarye mahayā vasiṣṭha |
Translation: 1. PRAYERS have been offered up through love of glory: Vasiṣṭha, honour Indra in the battle.

Sanskit Text: आ यो विश्वानि शवसा ततानोपश्रोता म ईवतो वचांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yo viśvāni śavasā tatānopaśrotā ma īvato vacāṃsi ||
Translation: He who with might extends through all existence hears words which I, his faithful servant, utter.

Sanskit Text: अयामि घोष इन्द्र देवजामिरिरज्यन्त यच्छुरुधो विवाचि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayāmi ghoṣa indra devajāmirirajyanta yacchurudho vivāci |
Translation: 2 A cry was raised which reached the Gods, O Indra, a cry to them to send us strength in combat.

Sanskit Text: नहि सवमायुश्चिकिते जनेषु तानीदंहांस्यति पर्ष्यस्मान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi svamāyuścikite janeṣu tānīdaṃhāṃsyati parṣyasmān ||
Translation: None among men knows his own life's duration: bear us in safety over these our troubles.

Sanskit Text: युजे रथं गवेषणं हरिभ्यामुप बरह्माणि जुजुषाणमस्थुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuje rathaṃ ghaveṣaṇaṃ haribhyāmupa brahmāṇi jujuṣāṇamasthuḥ |
Translation: 3 The Bays, the booty-seeking car I harness: my prayers have reached him who accepts them gladly.

Sanskit Text: वि बाधिष्ट सय रोदसी महित्वेन्द्रो वर्त्राण्यप्रती जघन्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi bādhiṣṭa sya rodasī mahitvendro vṛtrāṇyapratī jaghanvān ||
Translation: Indra, when he had slain resistless foemen, forced with his might the two world-halves asunder.

Sanskit Text: आपश्चित पिप्यु सतर्यो न गावो नक्षन्न्र्तं जरितारस्त इन्द्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpaścit pipyu staryo na ghāvo nakṣannṛtaṃ jaritārasta indra |
Translation: 4 Like barren cows, moreover, swelled the waters: the singen sought thy holy rite, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: याहि वायुर्न नियुतो न अछा तवं हि धीभिर्दयसे वि वाजान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāhi vāyurna niyuto na achā tvaṃ hi dhībhirdayase vi vājān ||
Translation: Come unto us as with his team comes Vāyu: thou, through our solemn hymns bestowest booty.

Sanskit Text: ते तवा मदा इन्द्र मादयन्तु शुष्मिणं तुविराधसं जरित्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te tvā madā indra mādayantu śuṣmiṇaṃ tuvirādhasaṃ jaritre |
Translation: 5 So may these gladdening draughts rejoice thee, Indra, the Mighty, very bounteous to the singer.

Sanskit Text: एको देवत्रा दयसे हि मर्तानस्मिञ्छूर सवने मादयस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eko devatrā dayase hi martānasmiñchūra savane mādayasva ||
Translation: Alone among the Gods thou pitiest mortals: O Hero, make thee glad at this libation.

Sanskit Text: एवेदिन्द्रं वर्षणं वज्रबाहुं वसिष्ठासो अभ्यर्चन्त्यर्कैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evedindraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vajrabāhuṃ vasiṣṭhāso abhyarcantyarkaiḥ |
Translation: 6 Thus the Vasisthas glorify with praises Indra, the Powerful whose arm wields thunder.

Sanskit Text: स न सतुतो वीरवत पातु गोमद यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa na stuto vīravat pātu ghomad yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Praised, may he guard our wealth in kine and heroes. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

Sanskit Text: योनिष ट इन्द्र सदने अकारि तमा नर्भिः पुरुहूत पर याहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yoniṣ ṭa indra sadane akāri tamā nṛbhiḥ puruhūta pra yāhi |
Translation: 1. A HOME is made for thee to dwell in, Indra: O Much-invoked, go thitherwith the heroes.

Sanskit Text: असो यथा नो.अविता वर्धे च ददो वसूनि ममदश्च सोमैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aso yathā no.avitā vṛdhe ca dado vasūni mamadaśca somaiḥ ||
Translation: That thou, to prosper us, mayst be our Helper, vouchsafe us wealth, rejoice with draughts of Soma.

Sanskit Text: गर्भीतं ते मन इन्द्र दविबर्हाः सुतः सोमः परिषिक्ता मधूनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛbhītaṃ te mana indra dvibarhāḥ sutaḥ somaḥ pariṣiktā madhūni |
Translation: 2 Indra, thy wish, twice-strong, is comprehended: pressed is the Soma, poured are pleasant juices.

Sanskit Text: विस्र्ष्टधेना भरते सुव्र्क्तिरियमिन्द्रं जोहुवती मनीषा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: visṛṣṭadhenā bharate suvṛktiriyamindraṃ johuvatī manīṣā ||
Translation: This hymn of praise, from loosened tongue, made perfect, draws Indra to itself with loud invoking.
