Sanskit Text: आ नो दिव आ पर्थिव्या रजीषिन्निदं बर्हिः सोमपेयाय याहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no diva ā pṛthivyā ṛjīṣinnidaṃ barhiḥ somapeyāya yāhi |
Translation: 3 Come, thou Impetuous; God, from earth or heaven; come to our holy grass to drink the Soma.

Sanskit Text: वहन्तु तवा हरयो मद्र्यञ्चमाङगूषमछा तवसं मदाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vahantu tvā harayo madryañcamāṅghūṣamachā tavasaṃ madāya ||
Translation: Hither to me let thy Bay Horses bring thee to listen to our hymns and make thee joyful.

Sanskit Text: आ नो विश्वाभिरूतिभिः सजोषा बरह्म जुषाणो हर्यश्वयाहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no viśvābhirūtibhiḥ sajoṣā brahma juṣāṇo haryaśvayāhi |
Translation: 4 Come unto us with all thine aids, accordant, Lord of Bay Steeds, accepting our devotions,

Sanskit Text: वरीव्र्जत सथविरेभिः सुशिप्रास्मे दधद वर्षणं शुष्ममिन्द्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: varīvṛjat sthavirebhiḥ suśiprāsme dadhad vṛṣaṇaṃ śuṣmamindra ||
Translation: Fair-helmeted, o’ercoming with the mighty, and lending us the strength of bulls, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: एष सतोमो मह उग्राय वाहे धुरीवात्यो न वाजयन्नधायि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa stomo maha ughrāya vāhe dhurīvātyo na vājayannadhāyi |
Translation: 5 As to the chariot pole a vigorous courser, this laud is brought to the great strong Upholder.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र तवायमर्क ईट्टे वसूनां दिवीव दयामधि नः शरोमतं धाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra tvāyamarka īṭṭe vasūnāṃ divīva dyāmadhi naḥ śromataṃ dhāḥ ||
Translation: This hymn solicits wealth of thee: in heaven, as ’twere above the sky, set thou our glory.

Sanskit Text: एवा न इन्द्र वार्यस्य पूर्धि पर ते महीं सुमतिं वेविदाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā na indra vāryasya pūrdhi pra te mahīṃ sumatiṃ vevidāma |
Translation: 6 With precious things. O Indra, thus content us: may we attain to thine exalted favour.

Sanskit Text: इषं पिन्व मघवद्भ्यः सुवीरां यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣaṃ pinva maghavadbhyaḥ suvīrāṃ yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Send our chiefs plenteous food with hero children. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: न सोम इन्द्रमसुतो ममाद नाब्रह्माणो मघवानं सुतासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na soma indramasuto mamāda nābrahmāṇo maghavānaṃ sutāsaḥ |
Translation: 1. SOMA unpressed ne’er gladdened liberal Indra, no juices pressed without a prayer have pleased him.

Sanskit Text: तस्मा उक्थं जनये यज्जुजोषन नर्वन नवीयः शर्णवद यथा नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmā ukthaṃ janaye yajjujoṣan nṛvan navīyaḥ śṛṇavad yathā naḥ ||
Translation: I generate a laud that shall delight him, new and heroic, so that he may hear us.

Sanskit Text: उक्थ-उक्थे सोम इन्द्रं ममाद नीथे-नीथे मघवानं सुतासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uktha-ukthe soma indraṃ mamāda nīthe-nīthe maghavānaṃ sutāsaḥ |
Translation: 2 At every laud the Soma gladdens Indra: pressed juices please him as each psalm is chanted,

Sanskit Text: यदीं सबाधः पितरं न पुत्राः समानदक्षा अवसे हवन्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadīṃ sabādhaḥ pitaraṃ na putrāḥ samānadakṣā avase havante ||
Translation: What time the priests with one united effort call him to aid, as sons invoke their father.

Sanskit Text: चकार ता कर्णवन नूनमन्या यानि बरुवन्ति वेधसः सुतेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakāra tā kṛṇavan nūnamanyā yāni bruvanti vedhasaḥ suteṣu |
Translation: 3 These deeds he did; let him achieve new exploits, such as the priests declare at their libations.

Sanskit Text: जनीरिव पतिरेकः समानो नि माम्र्जे पुर इन्द्रःसु सर्वाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: janīriva patirekaḥ samāno ni māmṛje pura indraḥsu sarvāḥ ||
Translation: Indra hath taken and possessed all castles, like as one common husband doth his spouses.

Sanskit Text: एवा तमाहुरुत शर्ण्व इन्द्र एको विभक्ता तरणिर्मघानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā tamāhuruta śṛṇva indra eko vibhaktā taraṇirmaghānām |
Translation: 4 Even thus have they declared him. Famed is Indra as Conqueror, sole distributer of treasures;

Sanskit Text: मिथस्तुर ऊतयो यस्य पूर्वीरस्मे भद्राणि सश्चतप्रियाणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mithastura ūtayo yasya pūrvīrasme bhadrāṇi saścatapriyāṇi ||
Translation: Whose many succours come in close succession. May dear delightful benefits attend us.

Sanskit Text: एवा वसिष्ठ इन्द्रमूतये नॄन कर्ष्टीनां वर्षभं सुते गर्णाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā vasiṣṭha indramūtaye nṝn kṛṣṭīnāṃ vṛṣabhaṃ sute ghṛṇāti |
Translation: 5 Thus, to bring help to men, Vasiṣṭha laudeth Indra, the peoples' Hero, at libation.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रिण उप नो माहि वाजान यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasriṇa upa no māhi vājān yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Bestow upon us strength and wealth in thousands. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं नरो नेमधिता हवन्ते यत पार्या युनजते धियस्ताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ naro nemadhitā havante yat pāryā yunajate dhiyastāḥ |
Translation: 1. MEN call on Indra in the armed encounter that he may make the hymns they sing decisive.

Sanskit Text: शूरो नर्षाता शवसश्चकान आ गोमति वरजे भजात्वं नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śūro nṛṣātā śavasaścakāna ā ghomati vraje bhajātvaṃ naḥ ||
Translation: Hero, rejoicing in thy might, in combat give us a portion of the stall of cattle,

Sanskit Text: य इन्द्र शुष्मो मघवन ते अस्ति शिक्षा सखिभ्यः पुरुहूतन्र्भ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya indra śuṣmo maghavan te asti śikṣā sakhibhyaḥ puruhūtanṛbhyaḥ |
Translation: 2 Grant, Indra Maghavan, invoked of many, to these my friends the strength which thou possessest.

Sanskit Text: तवं हि दर्ळ्हा मघवन विचेता अपा वर्धि परिव्र्तं न राधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hi dṛḷhā maghavan vicetā apā vṛdhi parivṛtaṃ na rādhaḥ ||
Translation: Thou, Maghavan, hast rent strong places open: unclose for us, Wise God, thy hidden bounty.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो राजा जगतश्चर्षणीनामधि कषमि विषुरूपं यदस्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro rājā jaghataścarṣaṇīnāmadhi kṣami viṣurūpaṃ yadasti |
Translation: 3 King of the living world, of men, is Indra, of all in varied form that earth containeth.

Sanskit Text: ततो ददाति दाशुषे वसूनि चोदद राध उपस्तुतश्चिदर्वाक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tato dadāti dāśuṣe vasūni codad rādha upastutaścidarvāk ||
Translation: Thence to the worshipper he giveth riches: may he enrich us also when we laud him.

Sanskit Text: नू चिन न इन्द्रो मघवा सहूती दानो वाजं नि यमते न ऊती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū cin na indro maghavā sahūtī dāno vājaṃ ni yamate na ūtī |
Translation: 4 Maghavan Indra, when we all invoke him, bountiful ever sendeth strength to aid us:

Sanskit Text: अनूना यस्य दक्षिणा पीपाय वामं नर्भ्यो अभिवीता सखिभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anūnā yasya dakṣiṇā pīpāya vāmaṃ nṛbhyo abhivītā sakhibhyaḥ ||
Translation: Whose perfect guerdon, never failing, bringeth wealth to the men, to friends the thing they covet.

Sanskit Text: नू इन्द्र राये वरिवस कर्धी न आ ते मनो वव्र्त्याम मघाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū indra rāye varivas kṛdhī na ā te mano vavṛtyāma maghāya |
Translation: 5 Quick, Indra, give us room and way to riches, and let us bring thy mind to grant us treasures,

Sanskit Text: गोमदश्वावद रथवद वयन्तो यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghomadaśvāvad rathavad vyanto yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: That we may win us cars and Steeds and cattle. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: बरह्मा ण इन्द्रोप याहि विद्वानर्वाञ्चस्ते हरयः सन्तु युक्ताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmā ṇa indropa yāhi vidvānarvāñcaste harayaḥ santu yuktāḥ |
Translation: 1. COME to our prayers, O Indra, thou who knowest: let thy Bay Steeds be yoked and guided hither.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे चिद धि तवा विहवन्त मर्ता अस्माकमिच्छ्र्णुहि विश्वमिन्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve cid dhi tvā vihavanta martā asmākamicchṛṇuhi viśvaminva ||
Translation: Though mortal men on every side invoke thee, still give thine ear to us, O All-impeller.

Sanskit Text: हवं त इन्द्र महिमा वयानड बरह्म यत पासि शवसिन्न्र्षीणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: havaṃ ta indra mahimā vyānaḍ brahma yat pāsi śavasinnṛṣīṇām |
Translation: 2 Thy greatness reacheth to our invocation, the sages' prayer which, Potent God, thou guardest.

Sanskit Text: आ यद वज्रं दधिषे हस्त उग्र घोरः सन करत्वा जनिष्ठा अषाळः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yad vajraṃ dadhiṣe hasta ughra ghoraḥ san kratvā janiṣṭhā aṣāḷaḥ ||
Translation: What time thy hand, O Mighty, holds the thunder, awful in strength thou hast become resistless.

Sanskit Text: तव परणीतीन्द्र जोहुवानान सं यन नॄन न रोदसी निनेथ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava praṇītīndra johuvānān saṃ yan nṝn na rodasī ninetha |
Translation: 3 What time thou drewest both world-halves together, like heroes led by thee who call each other-

Sanskit Text: महे कषत्राय शवसे हि जज्ञे.अतूतुजिं चित तूतुजिरशिश्नत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahe kṣatrāya śavase hi jajñe.atūtujiṃ cit tūtujiraśiśnat ||
Translation: For thou wast born for strength and high dominion-then e’en the active overthrew the sluggish.

Sanskit Text: एभिर्न इन्द्राहभिर्दशस्य दुर्मित्रासो हि कषितयः पवन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ebhirna indrāhabhirdaśasya durmitrāso hi kṣitayaḥ pavante |
Translation: 4 Honour us in these present days, O Indra, for hostile men are making expiation.

Sanskit Text: परति यच्चष्टे अन्र्तमनेना अव दविता वरुणो मायीनः सात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati yaccaṣṭe anṛtamanenā ava dvitā varuṇo māyīnaḥ sāt ||
Translation: Our sin that sinless Varuṇa discovered, the Wondrous-Wise hath long ago forgiven.

Sanskit Text: वोचेमेदिन्द्रं मघवानमेनं महो रायो राधसो यद ददन्नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vocemedindraṃ maghavānamenaṃ maho rāyo rādhaso yad dadannaḥ |
Translation: 5 We will address this liberal Lord, this Indra, that he may grant us gifts of ample riches,

Sanskit Text: यो अर्चतो बरह्मक्र्तिमविष्ठो यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo arcato brahmakṛtimaviṣṭho yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Best favourer of the singer's prayer and praises. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: शवित्यञ्चो मा दक्षिणतस्कपर्दा धियंजिन्वासो अभि हि परमन्दुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śvityañco mā dakṣiṇataskapardā dhiyaṃjinvāso abhi hi pramanduḥ |
Translation: 1. THESE who wear hair-knots on the right, the movers of holy thought, white-robed, have won me over.

Sanskit Text: उत्तिष्ठन वोचे परि बर्हिषो नॄन न मे दूरादवितवे वसिष्ठाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uttiṣṭhan voce pari barhiṣo nṝn na me dūrādavitave vasiṣṭhāḥ ||
Translation: I warned the men, when from the grass I raised me, Not from afar can my Vasisthas help you.

Sanskit Text: दूरादिन्द्रमनयन्ना सुतेन तिरो वैशन्तमति पान्तमुग्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūrādindramanayannā sutena tiro vaiśantamati pāntamughram |
Translation: 2 With

Sanskit Text: <a href="errata.htm#18">
Soma
they brought Indra from a distance, Over Vaisanta, from the strong libation.
पाशद्युम्नस्य वायतस्य सोमात सुतादिन्द्रो.अव्र्णीतावसिष्ठान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāśadyumnasya vāyatasya somāt sutādindro.avṛṇītāvasiṣṭhān ||
Translation: Indra preferred Vasisthas to the Soma pressed by the son of Vayata, Pasadyumna.

Sanskit Text: एवेन नु कं सिन्धुमेभिस्ततारेवेन नु कं भेदमेभिर्जघान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: even nu kaṃ sindhumebhistatāreven nu kaṃ bhedamebhirjaghāna |
Translation: 3 So, verily, with these he crossed the river, in company with these he slaughtered Bheda.

Sanskit Text: एवेन नु कं दाशराज्ञे सुदासं परावदिन्द्रो बरह्मणा वो वसिष्ठाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: even nu kaṃ dāśarājñe sudāsaṃ prāvadindro brahmaṇā vo vasiṣṭhāḥ ||
Translation: So in the fight with the Ten Kings, Vasisthas! did Indra help Sudās through your devotions.

Sanskit Text: जुष्टी नरो बरह्मणा वः पितॄणामक्षमव्ययं न किला रिषाथ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣṭī naro brahmaṇā vaḥ pitṝṇāmakṣamavyayaṃ na kilā riṣātha |
Translation: 4 I gladly, men I with prayer prayed by our fathers have fixed your axle: ye shall not be injured:

Sanskit Text: यच्छक्वरीषु बर्हता रवेणेन्द्रे शुष्ममदधाता वसिष्ठाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yacchakvarīṣu bṛhatā raveṇendre śuṣmamadadhātā vasiṣṭhāḥ ||
Translation: Since, when ye sang aloud the Sakvari verses, Vasisthas! ye invigorated Indra.

Sanskit Text: उद दयामिवेत तर्ष्णजो नाथितासो.अदीधयुर्दाशराज्ञे वर्तासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud dyāmivet tṛṣṇajo nāthitāso.adīdhayurdāśarājñe vṛtāsaḥ |
Translation: 5 Like thirsty men they looked to heaven, in battle with the Ten Kings, surrounded and imploring.

Sanskit Text: वसिष्ठस्य सतुवत इन्द्रो अश्रोदुरुं तर्त्सुभ्यो अक्र्णोदु लोकम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasiṣṭhasya stuvata indro aśroduruṃ tṛtsubhyo akṛṇodu lokam ||
Translation: Then Indra heard Vasiṣṭha as he praised him, and gave the Trtsus ample room and freedom.

Sanskit Text: दण्डा इवेद गोजनास आसन परिछिन्ना भरता अर्भकासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: daṇḍā ived ghoajanāsa āsan parichinnā bharatā arbhakāsaḥ |
Translation: 6 Like sticks and staves wherewith they drive the cattle, Stripped bare, the Bharatas were found defenceless:

Sanskit Text: अभवच्च पुरेता वसिष्ठ आदित तर्त्सूनां विशो अप्रथन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhavacca puraetā vasiṣṭha ādit tṛtsūnāṃ viśo aprathanta ||
Translation: Vasiṣṭha then became their chief and leader: then widely. were the Trtsus' clans extended.

Sanskit Text: तरयः कर्ण्वन्ति भुवनेषु रेतस्तिस्रः परजा आर्या जयोतिरग्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trayaḥ kṛṇvanti bhuvaneṣu retastisraḥ prajā āryā jyotiraghrāḥ |
Translation: 7 Three fertilize the worlds with genial moisture: three noble Creatures cast a light before them.

Sanskit Text: तरयो घर्मास उषसं सचन्ते सर्वानित ताननुविदुर्वसिष्ठाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trayo gharmāsa uṣasaṃ sacante sarvānit tānanuvidurvasiṣṭhāḥ ||
Translation: Three that give warmth to all attend the morning. All these have they discovered, these Vasisthas.

Sanskit Text: सूर्यस्येव वक्षथो जयोतिरेषां समुद्रस्येव महिमा गभीरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūryasyeva vakṣatho jyotireṣāṃ samudrasyeva mahimā ghabhīraḥ |
Translation: 8 Like the Sun's growing glory is their splendour, and like the sea's is their unflathomed greatness.

Sanskit Text: वातस्येव परजवो नान्येन सतोमो वसिष्ठा अन्वेतवे वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vātasyeva prajavo nānyena stomo vasiṣṭhā anvetave vaḥ ||
Translation: Their course is like the wind's. Your laud, Vasisthas, can never be attained by any other.

Sanskit Text: त इन निण्यं हर्दयस्य परकेतैः सहस्रवल्शमभि संचरन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta in niṇyaṃ hṛdayasya praketaiḥ sahasravalśamabhi saṃcaranti |
Translation: 9 They with perceptions of the heart in secret resort to that which spreads a thousand branches.

Sanskit Text: यमेन ततं परिधिं वयन्तो.अप्सरस उप सेदुर्वसिष्ठाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamena tataṃ paridhiṃ vayanto.apsarasa upa sedurvasiṣṭhāḥ ||
Translation: The Apsaras brought hither the Vasisthas wearing the vesture spun for them by Yama.

Sanskit Text: विद्युतो जयोतिः परि संजिहानं मित्रावरुणा यदपश्यतां तवा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidyuto jyotiḥ pari saṃjihānaṃ mitrāvaruṇā yadapaśyatāṃ tvā |
Translation: 10 A form of lustre springing from the lightning wast thou, when Varuṇa and Mitra saw thee.

Sanskit Text: तत ते जन्मोतैकं वसिष्ठागस्त्यो यत तवा विशाजभार ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat te janmotaikaṃ vasiṣṭhāghastyo yat tvā viśaājabhāra ||
Translation: Tliy one and only birth was then, Vasiṣṭha, when from thy stock Agastya brought thee hither.

Sanskit Text: उतासि मैत्रावरुणो वसिष्ठोर्वश्या बरह्मन मनसो.अधि जातः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: utāsi maitrāvaruṇo vasiṣṭhorvaśyā brahman manaso.adhi jātaḥ |
Translation: 11 Born of their love for Urvasi, Vasiṣṭha thou, priest, art son of Varuṇa and Mitra;

Sanskit Text: दरप्सं सकन्नं बरह्मणा दैव्येन विश्वे देवाः पुष्करे तवाददन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: drapsaṃ skannaṃ brahmaṇā daivyena viśve devāḥ puṣkare tvādadanta ||
Translation: And as a fallen drop, in heavenly fervour, all the Gods laid thee on a lotus-blossorn.

Sanskit Text: स परकेत उभयस्य परविद्वान सहस्रदान उत वा सदानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa praketa ubhayasya pravidvān sahasradāna uta vā sadānaḥ |
Translation: 12 He thinker, knower both of earth and heaven, endowed with many a gift, bestowing thousands,

Sanskit Text: यमेन ततं परिधिं वयिष्यन्नप्सरसः परि जज्ञे वसिष्ठः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamena tataṃ paridhiṃ vayiṣyannapsarasaḥ pari jajñe vasiṣṭhaḥ ||
Translation: Destined to wear the vesture spun by Yama, sprang from the Apsaras to life, Vasiṣṭha.

Sanskit Text: सत्रे ह जाताविषिता नमोभिः कुम्भे रेतः सिषिचतुः समानम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satre ha jātāviṣitā namobhiḥ kumbhe retaḥ siṣicatuḥ samānam |
Translation: 13 Born at the sacrifice, urged by adorations, both with a common flow bedewed the pitcher.

Sanskit Text: ततो ह मान उदियाय मध्यात ततो जातं रषिमाहुर्वसिष्ठम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tato ha māna udiyāya madhyāt tato jātaṃ ṛṣimāhurvasiṣṭham ||
Translation: Then from the midst thereof there rose up Māna, and thence they say was born the sage Vasiṣṭha.

Sanskit Text: उक्थभ्र्तं सामभ्र्तं बिभर्ति गरावाणं बिभ्रत पर वदात्यग्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukthabhṛtaṃ sāmabhṛtaṃ bibharti ghrāvāṇaṃ bibhrat pra vadātyaghre |
Translation: 14 He brings the bearer of the laud and Sāman: first shall he speak bringing the stone for pressing.

Sanskit Text: उपैनमाध्वं सुमनस्यमाना आ वो गछाति परत्र्दो वसिष्ठः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upainamādhvaṃ sumanasyamānā ā vo ghachāti pratṛdo vasiṣṭhaḥ ||
Translation: With grateful hearts in reverence approach him: to you, O Pratrdas, Vasiṣṭha cometh.

Sanskit Text: पर शुक्रैतु देवी मनीषा अस्मत सुतष्टो रथो न वाजी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra śukraitu devī manīṣā asmat sutaṣṭo ratho na vājī ||
Translation: 1. MAY our divine and brilliant hymn go forth, like a swift chariot wrought and fashioned well.

Sanskit Text: विदुः पर्थिव्या दिवो जनित्रं शर्ण्वन्त्यापो अध कषरन्तीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viduḥ pṛthivyā divo janitraṃ śṛṇvantyāpo adha kṣarantīḥ ||
Translation: 2 The waters listen as they flow along: they know the origin of heaven and earth.

Sanskit Text: आपश्चिदस्मै पिन्वन्त पर्थ्वीर्व्र्त्रेषु शूरा मंसन्त उग्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpaścidasmai pinvanta pṛthvīrvṛtreṣu śūrā maṃsanta ughrāḥ ||
Translation: 3 Yea, the broad waters swell their flood ior him: of him strong heroes think amid their foes.

Sanskit Text: आ धूर्ष्वस्मै दधाताश्वानिन्द्रो न वज्री हिरण्यबाहुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā dhūrṣvasmai dadhātāśvānindro na vajrī hiraṇyabāhuḥ ||
Translation: 4 Set ye for him the coursers to the pole: like Indra Thunderer is the Golden-armed.

Sanskit Text: अभि पर सथाताहेव यज्ञं यातेव पत्मन तमना हिनोत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi pra sthātāheva yajñaṃ yāteva patman tmanā hinota ||
Translation: 5 Arouse you, like the days, to sacrifice speed gladly like a traveller on the way.

Sanskit Text: तमना समत्सु हिनोत यज्ञं दधात केतुं जनाय वीरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tmanā samatsu hinota yajñaṃ dadhāta ketuṃ janāya vīram ||
Translation: 6 Go swift to battles, to the sacrifice: set up a flag, a hero for the folk.

Sanskit Text: उदस्य शुष्माद भानुर्नार्त बिभर्ति भारं पर्थिवी नभूम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: udasya śuṣmād bhānurnārta bibharti bhāraṃ pṛthivī nabhūma ||
Translation: 7 Up from his strength hath risen as ’twere a light: it bears the load as earth bears living things.

Sanskit Text: हवयामि देवानयातुरग्ने साधन्न्र्तेन धियं दधामि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hvayāmi devānayāturaghne sādhannṛtena dhiyaṃ dadhāmi ||
Translation: 8 Agni, no demon I invoke the Gods: by law completing it, I form a hymn.

Sanskit Text: अभि वो देवीं धियं दधिध्वं पर वो देवत्रा वाचं कर्णुध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi vo devīṃ dhiyaṃ dadhidhvaṃ pra vo devatrā vācaṃ kṛṇudhvam ||
Translation: 9 Closely albout you lay your heavenly song, and send your voice to where the Gods abide.

Sanskit Text: आ चष्ट आसां पाथो नदीनां वरुण उग्रः सहस्रचक्षाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā caṣṭa āsāṃ pātho nadīnāṃ varuṇa ughraḥ sahasracakṣāḥ ||
Translation: 10 Varuṇa, Mighty, with a thousand eyes, beholds the paths wherein these rivers run.

Sanskit Text: राजा राष्ट्रानां पेशो नदीनामनुत्तमस्मै कषत्रं विश्वायु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājā rāṣṭrānāṃ peśo nadīnāmanuttamasmai kṣatraṃ viśvāyu ||
Translation: 11 He, King of kings, the glory of the floods, o’er all that liveth hath resistless sway.

Sanskit Text: अविष्टो अस्मान विश्वासु विक्ष्वद्युं कर्णोत शंसं निनित्सोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aviṣṭo asmān viśvāsu vikṣvadyuṃ kṛṇota śaṃsaṃ ninitsoḥ ||
Translation: 12 May he assist us among all the tribes, and make the envier's praise devoid of light.

Sanskit Text: वयेतु दिद्युद दविषामशेवा युयोत विष्वग रपस्तनूनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyetu didyud dviṣāmaśevā yuyota viṣvagh rapastanūnām ||
Translation: 13 May the foes' threatening arrow pass us by: may he put far from us our bodies' sin.

Sanskit Text: अवीन नो अग्निर्हव्यान नमोभिः परेष्ठो अस्मा अधायि सतोमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avīn no aghnirhavyān namobhiḥ preṣṭho asmā adhāyi stomaḥ ||
Translation: 14 Agni, oblation-cater, through our prayers aid us: to him our dearest laud is brought.

Sanskit Text: सजूर्देवेभिरपां नपातं सखायं कर्ध्वं शिवो नो अस्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajūrdevebhirapāṃ napātaṃ sakhāyaṃ kṛdhvaṃ śivo no astu ||
Translation: 15 Accordant with the Gods choose for our Friend the Waters’ Child: may he be good to us.

Sanskit Text: अब्जामुक्थैरहिं गर्णीषे बुध्ने नदीनां रजस्सु षीदन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abjāmukthairahiṃ ghṛṇīṣe budhne nadīnāṃ rajassu ṣīdan ||
Translation: 16 With lauds I sing the Dragon born of floods: he sits beneath the streams in middle air.

Sanskit Text: मा नो.अहिर्बुध्न्यो रिषे धान मा यज्ञो अस्य सरिधद रतायोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no.ahirbudhnyo riṣe dhān mā yajño asya sridhad ṛtāyoḥ ||
Translation: 17 Ne’er may the Dragon of the Deep harm us: ne’er fail this faithful servant's sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: उत न एषु नर्षु शरवो धुः पर राये यन्तु शर्धन्तो अर्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta na eṣu nṛṣu śravo dhuḥ pra rāye yantu śardhanto aryaḥ ||
Translation: 18 To these our heroes may they grant renown: may pious men march boldly on to wealth.

Sanskit Text: तपन्ति शत्रुं सवर्ण भूमा महासेनासो अमेभिरेषाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tapanti śatruṃ svarṇa bhūmā mahāsenāso amebhireṣām ||
Translation: 19 Leading great hosts, with fierce attacks of these, they burn their foes as the Sun burns the earth.

Sanskit Text: आ यन नः पत्नीर्गमन्त्यछा तवष्टा सुपाणिर्दधातुवीरान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yan naḥ patnīrghamantyachā tvaṣṭā supāṇirdadhātuvīrān ||
Translation: 20 What time our wives draw near to us, may he, left-handed Tvaṣṭar, give us hero sons.

Sanskit Text: परति न सतोमं तवष्टा जुषेत सयादस्मे अरमतिर्वसूयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati na stomaṃ tvaṣṭā juṣeta syādasme aramatirvasūyuḥ ||
Translation: 21 May Tvaṣṭar find our hymn acceptable, and may Aramati, seeking wealth, be ours.

Sanskit Text: ता नो रासन रातिषाचो वसून्या रोदसी वरुणानी शर्णोतु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā no rāsan rātiṣāco vasūnyā rodasī varuṇānī śṛṇotu |
Translation: 22 May they who lavish gifts bestow those treasures: may Rodasī and Varuṇānī listen.

Sanskit Text: वरूत्रीभिः सुशरणो नो अस्तु तवष्टा सुदत्रो वि दधातु रायः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: varūtrībhiḥ suśaraṇo no astu tvaṣṭā sudatro vi dadhātu rāyaḥ ||
Translation: May he, with the Varūtrīs, be our refuge, may bountiful Tvaṣṭar give us store of riches.

Sanskit Text: तन नो रायः पर्वतास्तन न आपस्तद रातिषाच ओषधीरुत दयौः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no rāyaḥ parvatāstan na āpastad rātiṣāca oṣadhīruta dyauḥ |
Translation: 23 So may rich Mountains and the liberal Waters, so may all Herbs that grow on ground, and Heaven,

Sanskit Text: वनस्पतिभिः पर्थिवी सजोषा उभे रोदसी परि पासतो नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanaspatibhiḥ pṛthivī sajoṣā ubhe rodasī pari pāsato naḥ ||
Translation: And Earth accordant with the Forest-Sovrans, and both the World-halves round about protect us.

Sanskit Text: अनु तदुर्वी रोदसी जिहातामनु दयुक्षो वरुण इन्द्रसखा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu tadurvī rodasī jihātāmanu dyukṣo varuṇa indrasakhā |
Translation: 24 To this may both the wide Worlds lend approval, and Varuṇa in heaven, whose Friend is Indra.

Sanskit Text: अनु विश्वे मरुतो ये सहासो रायः सयाम धरुणं धियध्यै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu viśve maruto ye sahāso rāyaḥ syāma dharuṇaṃ dhiyadhyai ||
Translation: May all the Maruts give consent, the Victors, that we may hold great wealth in firm possession.

Sanskit Text: तन न इन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निराप ओषधीर्वनिनो जुषन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan na indro varuṇo mitro aghnirāpa oṣadhīrvanino juṣanta |
Translation: 25 May Indra, Varuṇa, Mitra, and Agni, Waters, Herbs, Trees accept the praise we offer.

Sanskit Text: शर्मन सयाम मरुतामुपस्थे यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śarman syāma marutāmupasthe yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: May we find refuge in the Marut's bosom. Protect us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: शं न इन्द्राग्नी भवतामवोभिः शं न इन्द्रावरुणा रातहव्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ na indrāghnī bhavatāmavobhiḥ śaṃ na indrāvaruṇā rātahavyā |
Translation: 1. BEFRIEND us with their aids Indra and Agni, Indra and Varuṇa who receive oblations!

Sanskit Text: शमिन्द्रासोमा सुविताय शं योः शं न इन्द्रापूषणा वाजसातौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śamindrāsomā suvitāya śaṃ yoḥ śaṃ na indrāpūṣaṇā vājasātau ||
Translation: Indra and Soma give health, strength and comfort, Indra and Pūṣan be our help in battle.

Sanskit Text: शं नो भगः शमु नः शंसो अस्तु शं नः पुरन्धिःशमु सन्तु रायः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no bhaghaḥ śamu naḥ śaṃso astu śaṃ naḥ purandhiḥśamu santu rāyaḥ |
Translation: 2 Auspicious Friends to us be Bhaga, Sathsa, auspicious be Purandhi aid all Riches;

Sanskit Text: शं नः सत्यस्य सुयमस्य शंसःशं नो अर्यमा पुरुजातो अस्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ naḥ satyasya suyamasya śaṃsaḥśaṃ no aryamā purujāto astu ||
Translation: The blessing of the true and well-conducted, and Aryaman in many forms apparent.

Sanskit Text: शं नो धाता शमु धर्ता नो अस्तु शं न उरूची भवतुस्वधाभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no dhātā śamu dhartā no astu śaṃ na urūcī bhavatusvadhābhiḥ |
Translation: 3 Kind unto us he Maker and Sustainer, and the far-reaching Pair with God-like natures.

Sanskit Text: शं रोदसी बर्हती शं नो अद्रिः शं नोदेवानां सुहवानि सन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ rodasī bṛhatī śaṃ no adriḥ śaṃ nodevānāṃ suhavāni santu ||
Translation: Auspicious unto us be Earth and Heaven, the Mountain, and the Gods’ fair invocations.

Sanskit Text: शं नो अग्निर्ज्योतिरनीको अस्तु शं नो मित्रावरुणावश्विना शम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no aghnirjyotiranīko astu śaṃ no mitrāvaruṇāvaśvinā śam |
Translation: 4 Favour us Agni with his face of splendour, and Varuva and Mitra and the Aśvins.

Sanskit Text: शं नः सुक्र्तां सुक्र्तानि सन्तु शं न इषिरोभि वातु वातः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ naḥ sukṛtāṃ sukṛtāni santu śaṃ na iṣiroabhi vātu vātaḥ ||
Translation: Favour us noble actions of the pious, impetuous vita blow on us with favour.

Sanskit Text: शं नो दयावाप्र्थिवी पूर्वहूतौ शमन्तरिक्षं दर्शयेनो अस्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no dyāvāpṛthivī pūrvahūtau śamantarikṣaṃ dṛśayeno astu |
Translation: 5 Early invoked, may Heaven and Earth be friendly, and Air's mid-region good for us to look on.

Sanskit Text: शं न ओषधीर्वनिनो भवन्तु शं नो रजसस पतिरस्तु जिष्णुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ na oṣadhīrvanino bhavantu śaṃ no rajasas patirastu jiṣṇuḥ ||
Translation: To us may Herbs and Forest-Trees be gracious, gracious the Lord Victorious of the region.

Sanskit Text: शं न इन्द्रो वसुभिर्देवो अस्तु शमादित्येभिर्वरुणः सुशंसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ na indro vasubhirdevo astu śamādityebhirvaruṇaḥ suśaṃsaḥ |
Translation: 6 Be the God Indra with the Vasus friendly, and, with Ādityas, Varuṇa who blesseth.

Sanskit Text: शं नो रुद्रो रुद्रेभिर्जलाषः शं नस्त्वष्टा गनाभिरिह शर्णोतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no rudro rudrebhirjalāṣaḥ śaṃ nastvaṣṭā ghnābhiriha śṛṇotu ||
Translation: Kind, with the Rudras, be the Healer Rudra, and, with the Dames, may Tvaṣṭar kindly listen.

Sanskit Text: शं नः सोमो भवतु बरह्म शं नः शं नो गरावाणःशमु सन्तु यज्ञाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ naḥ somo bhavatu brahma śaṃ naḥ śaṃ no ghrāvāṇaḥśamu santu yajñāḥ |
Translation: 7 Blest unto us be Soma, and devotions, blest be the Sacrifice, the Stones for pressing.

Sanskit Text: शं नः सवरूणां मितयो भवन्तु शं नः परस्वः शं वस्तु वेदिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ naḥ svarūṇāṃ mitayo bhavantu śaṃ naḥ prasvaḥ śaṃ vastu vediḥ ||
Translation: Blest be the fixing of the sacred Pillars, blest be the tender Grass and blest the Altar.

Sanskit Text: शं नः सूर्य उरुचक्षा उदेतु शं नश्चतस्रः परदिशो भवन्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ naḥ sūrya urucakṣā udetu śaṃ naścatasraḥ pradiśo bhavantu |
Translation: 8 May the far-seeing Sun rise up to bless us: be the four Quarters of the sky auspicious.

Sanskit Text: शं नः पर्वता धरुवयो भवन्तु शं नः सिन्धवः शमु सन्त्वापः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ naḥ parvatā dhruvayo bhavantu śaṃ naḥ sindhavaḥ śamu santvāpaḥ ||
Translation: Auspicious be the firmly-seated Mountains, auspicious be the Rivers and the Waters.

Sanskit Text: शं नो अदितिर्भवतु वरतेभिः शं नो भवन्तु मरुतः सवर्काः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no aditirbhavatu vratebhiḥ śaṃ no bhavantu marutaḥ svarkāḥ |
Translation: 9 May Adid through holy works be gracioas, and may the Maruts, loud in song, be friendly.

Sanskit Text: शं नो विष्णुः शं उ पूषा नो अस्तु शं नो भवित्रं शं वस्तु वायुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no viṣṇuḥ śaṃ u pūṣā no astu śaṃ no bhavitraṃ śaṃ vastu vāyuḥ ||
Translation: May Viṣṇu give felicity, and Pūṣan, the Air that cherisheth our life, and Vāyu.

Sanskit Text: शं नो देवः सविता तरायमाणः शं नो भवन्तूषसो विभातीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no devaḥ savitā trāyamāṇaḥ śaṃ no bhavantūṣaso vibhātīḥ |
Translation: 10 Prosper us Savitar, the God who rescues, and let the radiant Mornings be propitious.

Sanskit Text: शं नः पर्जन्यो भवतु परजाभ्यः शं नःक्षेत्रस्य पतिरस्तु शम्भुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ naḥ parjanyo bhavatu prajābhyaḥ śaṃ naḥkṣetrasya patirastu śambhuḥ ||
Translation: Auspicious to all creatures be Parjanya, auspicious be the field's benign Protector.

Sanskit Text: शं नो देवा विश्वदेवा भवन्तु शं सरस्वती सह धीभिरस्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no devā viśvadevā bhavantu śaṃ sarasvatī saha dhībhirastu |
Translation: 11 May all the fellowship of Gods befriend us, Sarasvatī, with Holy Thoughts, be gracious.

Sanskit Text: शमभिषाचः शमु रातिषाचः शं नो दिव्याः पार्थिवाः शं नो अप्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śamabhiṣācaḥ śamu rātiṣācaḥ śaṃ no divyāḥ pārthivāḥ śaṃ no apyāḥ ||
Translation: Friendly be they, the Liberal Ones who seek us, yea, those who dwell in heaven, on earth, in waters.

Sanskit Text: शं नः सत्यस्य पतयो भवन्तु शं नो अर्वन्तः शमु सन्तु गावः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ naḥ satyasya patayo bhavantu śaṃ no arvantaḥ śamu santu ghāvaḥ |
Translation: 12 May the great Lords of Truth protect and aid us: blest to us be our horses and our cattle.

Sanskit Text: शं न रभवः सुक्र्तः सुहस्ताः शं नो भवन्तु पितरो हवेषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ na ṛbhavaḥ sukṛtaḥ suhastāḥ śaṃ no bhavantu pitaro haveṣu ||
Translation: Kind be the pious skilful-handed Ṛbhus, kind be the Fathers at our invocations.

Sanskit Text: शं नो अज एकपाद देवो अस्तु शं नो.अहिर्बुध्न्यः शं समुद्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no aja ekapād devo astu śaṃ no.ahirbudhnyaḥ śaṃ samudraḥ |
Translation: 13 May Aja-Ekapād, the God, be gracious, gracious the Dragon of the Deep, and Ocean.

Sanskit Text: शं नो अपां नपात पेरुरस्तु शं नः पर्श्निर्भवतु देवगोपा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no apāṃ napāt perurastu śaṃ naḥ pṛśnirbhavatu devaghopā ||
Translation: Gracious be he the swelling Child of Waters, gracious be Pṛśni who hath Gods to guard her.

Sanskit Text: आदित्या रुद्रा वसवो जुषन्तेदं बरह्म करियमाणं नवीयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityā rudrā vasavo juṣantedaṃ brahma kriyamāṇaṃ navīyaḥ |
Translation: 14 So may the Rudras, Vasus, and Ādityas accept the new hymn which we now are making.

Sanskit Text: शर्ण्वन्तु नि दिव्याः पार्थिवासो गोजाता उत ये यज्ञियासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇvantu ni divyāḥ pārthivāso ghojātā uta ye yajñiyāsaḥ ||
Translation: May all the Holy Ones of earth and heaven, and the Cow's offipring hear our invocation.

Sanskit Text: ये देवानां यज्ञिया यज्ञियानां मनोर्यजत्रा अम्र्ता रतज्ञाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye devānāṃ yajñiyā yajñiyānāṃ manoryajatrā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ |
Translation: 15 They who of Holy Gods are very holy, Immortal, knowing Law, whom man must worship,—

Sanskit Text: ते नो रासन्तामुरुगायमद्य यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te no rāsantāmurughāyamadya yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: May these to-day give us broad paths to travel. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: पर बरह्मैतु सदनाद रतस्य वि रश्मिभिः सस्र्जे सूर्यो गाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra brahmaitu sadanād ṛtasya vi raśmibhiḥ sasṛje sūryo ghāḥ |
Translation: 1. LET the prayer issue from the seat of Order, for Sūrya with his beams hath loosed the cattle.

Sanskit Text: वि सानुना पर्थिवी सस्र उर्वी पर्थु परतीकमध्येधे अग्निः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi sānunā pṛthivī sasra urvī pṛthu pratīkamadhyedhe aghniḥ ||
Translation: With lofty ridges earth is far extended, and Agni's flame hath lit the spacious surface.

Sanskit Text: इमां वां मित्रावरुणा सुव्र्क्तिमिषं न कर्ण्वे असुरा नवीयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imāṃ vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā suvṛktimiṣaṃ na kṛṇve asurā navīyaḥ |
Translation: 2 O Asuras, O Varuṇa and Mitra, this hymn to you, like food, anew I offer.

Sanskit Text: इनो वामन्यः पदवीरदब्धो जनं च मित्रो यतति बरुवाणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ino vāmanyaḥ padavīradabdho janaṃ ca mitro yatati bruvāṇaḥ ||
Translation: One of you is a strong unerring Leader, and Mitra, speaking, stirreth men to labour.

Sanskit Text: आ वातस्य धरजतो रन्त इत्या अपीपयन्त धेनवो न सूदाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vātasya dhrajato ranta ityā apīpayanta dhenavo na sūdāḥ |
Translation: 3 The movements of the gliding wind come hither: like cows, the springs are filled to overflowing.

Sanskit Text: महो दिवः सदने जायमानो.अचिक्रदद वर्षभः सस्मिन्नूधन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maho divaḥ sadane jāyamāno.acikradad vṛṣabhaḥ sasminnūdhan ||
Translation: Born in the station e’en of lofty heaven the Bull hath loudly bellowed in this region.

Sanskit Text: गिरा य एता युनजद धरी त इन्द्र परिया सुरथा शूर धायू |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghirā ya etā yunajad dharī ta indra priyā surathā śūra dhāyū |
Translation: 4 May I bring hither with my song, O Indra, wise Aryaman who yokes thy dear Bay Horses,

Sanskit Text: पर यो मन्युं रिरिक्षतो मिनात्या सुक्रतुमर्यमणं वव्र्त्याम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yo manyuṃ ririkṣato minātyā sukratumaryamaṇaṃ vavṛtyām ||
Translation: Voracious, with thy noble car, O Hero, him who defeats the wrath of the malicious.

Sanskit Text: यजन्ते अस्य सख्यं वयश्च नमस्विनः सव रतस्य धामन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajante asya sakhyaṃ vayaśca namasvinaḥ sva ṛtasya dhāman |
Translation: 5 In their own place of sacrifice adorers worship to gain long life and win his friendship.

Sanskit Text: वि पर्क्षो बाबधे नर्भि सतवान इदं नमो रुद्राय परेष्ठम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi pṛkṣo bābadhe nṛbhi stavāna idaṃ namo rudrāya preṣṭham ||
Translation: He hath poured food on men when they have praised him; be this, the dearest reverence, paid to Rudra.

Sanskit Text: आ यत साकं यशसो वावशानाः सरस्वती सप्तथी सिन्धुमाता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yat sākaṃ yaśaso vāvaśānāḥ sarasvatī saptathī sindhumātā |
Translation: 6 Coming together, glorious, loudly roaring - Sarasvatī, Mother of Floods, the seventh-

Sanskit Text: याः सुष्वयन्त सुदुघाः सुधारा अभि सवेन पयसा पीप्यानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāḥ suṣvayanta sudughāḥ sudhārā abhi svena payasā pīpyānāḥ ||
Translation: With copious milk, with fair streams, strongly flowing, full swelling with the volume of their water;

Sanskit Text: उत तये नो मरुतो मन्दसाना धियं तोकं च वाजिनो.अवन्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tye no maruto mandasānā dhiyaṃ tokaṃ ca vājino.avantu |
Translation: 7. And may the mighty Maruts, too, rejoicing, aid our devotion and protect our offspring.

Sanskit Text: मा नः परि खयदक्षरा चरन्त्यवीव्र्धन युज्यं ते रयिं नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā naḥ pari khyadakṣarā carantyavīvṛdhan yujyaṃ te rayiṃ naḥ ||
Translation: Let not swift-moving Aksara neglect us: they have increased our own appropriate riches,

Sanskit Text: पर वो महीमरमतिं कर्णुध्वं पर पूषणं विदथ्यं न वीरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vo mahīmaramatiṃ kṛṇudhvaṃ pra pūṣaṇaṃ vidathyaṃ na vīram |
Translation: 8 Bring ye the great Aramati before you, and Pūṣan as the Hero of the synod,

Sanskit Text: भगं धियो.अवितारं नो अस्याः सातौ वाजं रातिषाचं पुरन्धिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhaghaṃ dhiyo.avitāraṃ no asyāḥ sātau vājaṃ rātiṣācaṃ purandhim ||
Translation: Bhaga who looks upon this hymn with favour, and, as our strength, the bountiful Purandbi.

Sanskit Text: अछायं वो मरुतः शलोक एत्वछा विष्णुं निषिक्तपामवोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: achāyaṃ vo marutaḥ śloka etvachā viṣṇuṃ niṣiktapāmavobhiḥ |
Translation: 9 May this our song of praise reach you, O Maruts, and Viṣṇu guardian of the future infant.

Sanskit Text: उत परजायै गर्णते वयो धुर्यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta prajāyai ghṛṇate vayo dhuryūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: May they vouchsafe the singer strength for offspring. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: आ वो वाहिष्ठो वहतु सतवध्यै रथो वाजा रभुक्षणो अम्र्क्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vo vāhiṣṭho vahatu stavadhyai ratho vājā ṛbhukṣaṇo amṛktaḥ |
Translation: 1. LET your best-bearing car that must be lauded, ne’er injured, bring you Vājas and Ṛbhukṣans.

Sanskit Text: अभि तरिप्र्ष्ठैः सवनेषु सोमैर्मदे सुशिप्रा महभिः पर्णध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tripṛṣṭhaiḥ savaneṣu somairmade suśiprā mahabhiḥ pṛṇadhvam ||
Translation: Fill you, fair-helmeted! with mighty Soma, thrice-mixed, at our libations to delight you.

Sanskit Text: यूयं ह रत्नं मघवत्सु धत्थ सवर्द्र्श रभुक्षणो अम्र्क्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyaṃ ha ratnaṃ maghavatsu dhattha svardṛśa ṛbhukṣaṇo amṛktam |
Translation: 2 Ye who behold the light of heaven, Ṛbhukṣans, give our rich patrons unmolested riches.

Sanskit Text: सं यज्ञेषु सवधावन्तः पिबध्वं वि नो राधांसि मतिभिर्दयध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yajñeṣu svadhāvantaḥ pibadhvaṃ vi no rādhāṃsi matibhirdayadhvam ||
Translation: Drink, heavenly-natured. at our sacrifices, and give us bounties for the hymns we sing you.

Sanskit Text: उवोचिथ हि मघवन देष्णं महो अर्भस्य वसुनो विभागे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uvocitha hi maghavan deṣṇaṃ maho arbhasya vasuno vibhāghe |
Translation: 3 For thou, O Bounteous One, art used to giving, at parting treasure whether small or ample.

Sanskit Text: उभा ते पूर्णा वसुना गभस्ती न सून्र्ता नि यमते वसव्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhā te pūrṇā vasunā ghabhastī na sūnṛtā ni yamate vasavyā ||
Translation: Filled full are both thine arms with great possessions: thy goodness keeps thee not from granting riches.

Sanskit Text: तवमिन्द्र सवयशा रभुक्षा वाजो न साधुरस्तमेष्य रक्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamindra svayaśā ṛbhukṣā vājo na sādhurastameṣy ṛkvā |
Translation: 4 Indra, high-famed, as Vāja and Ṛbhukṣans, thou goest working, singing to the dwelling.

Sanskit Text: वयं नु ते दाश्वांसः सयाम बरह्म कर्ण्वन्तो हरिवो वसिष्ठाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ nu te dāśvāṃsaḥ syāma brahma kṛṇvanto harivo vasiṣṭhāḥ ||
Translation: Lord of Bay Steeds, this day may we Vasisthas offer our prayers to thee and bring oblations.

Sanskit Text: सनितासि परवतो दाशुषे चिद याभिर्विवेषो हर्यश्व धीभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanitāsi pravato dāśuṣe cid yābhirviveṣo haryaśva dhībhiḥ |
Translation: 5 Thou winnest swift advancement for thy servant, through hymns, Lord of Bay Steeds, which thou hast favoured.

Sanskit Text: ववन्मा नु ते युज्याभिरूती कदा न इन्द्र राय आ दशस्येः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vavanmā nu te yujyābhirūtī kadā na indra rāya ā daśasyeḥ ||
Translation: For thee with friendly succour have we battled, and when, O Indra, wilt thou grant us riches?

Sanskit Text: वासयसीव वेधसस्त्वं नः कदा न इन्द्र वचसो बुबोधः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāsayasīva vedhasastvaṃ naḥ kadā na indra vacaso bubodhaḥ |
Translation: 6 To us thy priests a home, as ’twere, thou givest: when, Indra wilt thou recognize our praises?

Sanskit Text: अस्तं तात्या धिया रयिं सुवीरं पर्क्षो नो अर्वा नयुहीत वाजी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: astaṃ tātyā dhiyā rayiṃ suvīraṃ pṛkṣo no arvā nyuhīta vājī ||
Translation: May thy strong Steed, through our ancestral worship, bring food and wealth with heroes to our dwelling.

Sanskit Text: अभि यं देवी निरतिश्चिदीशे नक्षन्त इन्द्रं शरदःसुप्र्क्षः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi yaṃ devī nirtiścidīśe nakṣanta indraṃ śaradaḥsupṛkṣaḥ |
Translation: 7 Though Nirrti the Goddess reigneth round him, Autumns with food in plenty come to Indra.

Sanskit Text: उप तरिबन्धुर्जरदष्टिमेत्यस्ववेशं यं कर्णवन्त मर्ताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa tribandhurjaradaṣṭimetyasvaveśaṃ yaṃ kṛṇavanta martāḥ ||
Translation: With three close Friends to length of days he cometh, he whom men let not rest at home in quiet.

Sanskit Text: आ नो राधांसि सवितः सतवध्या आ रायो यन्तु पर्वतस्यरातौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no rādhāṃsi savitaḥ stavadhyā ā rāyo yantu parvatasyarātau |
Translation: 8 Promise us gifts, O Savitar: may riches come unto us in Parvata's full bounty.

Sanskit Text: सदा नो दिव्यः पायुः सिषक्तु यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadā no divyaḥ pāyuḥ siṣaktu yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: May the Celestial Guardian still attend us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: उदु षय देवः सविता ययाम हिरण्ययीममतिं यामशिश्रेत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udu ṣya devaḥ savitā yayāma hiraṇyayīmamatiṃ yāmaśiśret |
Translation: 1. ON high hath Savitar, this God, extended the golden lustre which he spreads around him.

Sanskit Text: नूनं भगो हव्यो मानुषेभिर्वि यो रत्ना पुरूवसुर्दधाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nūnaṃ bhagho havyo mānuṣebhirvi yo ratnā purūvasurdadhāti ||
Translation: Now, now must Bhaga be invoked by mortals, Lord of great riches who distributes treasures.

Sanskit Text: उदु तिष्ठ सवितः शरुध्यस्य हिरण्यपाणे परभ्र्ताव रतस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udu tiṣṭha savitaḥ śrudhyasya hiraṇyapāṇe prabhṛtāv ṛtasya |
Translation: 2 Rise up, O Savitar whose hands are golden, and hear this man while sacrifice is offered,

Sanskit Text: वयुर्वीं पर्थ्वीममतिं सर्जान आ नर्भ्यो मर्तभोजनं सुवानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyurvīṃ pṛthvīmamatiṃ sṛjāna ā nṛbhyo martabhojanaṃ suvānaḥ ||
Translation: Spreading afar thy broad and wide effulgence, and bringing mortal men the food that feeds them.

Sanskit Text: अपि षटुतः सविता देवो अस्तु यमा चिद विश्वे वसवो गर्णन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: api ṣṭutaḥ savitā devo astu yamā cid viśve vasavo ghṛṇanti |
Translation: 3 Let Savitar the God he hymned with praises, to whom the Vasus, even, all sing glory.

Sanskit Text: स न सतोमान नमस्यश्चनो धाद विश्वेभिः पातु पायुभिर्नि सूरीन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa na stomān namasyaścano dhād viśvebhiḥ pātu pāyubhirni sūrīn ||
Translation: Sweet be our lauds to him whose due is worship: may he with all protection guard our princes.

Sanskit Text: अभि यं देव्यदितिर्ग्र्णाति सवं देवस्य सवितुर्जुषाणा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi yaṃ devyaditirghṛṇāti savaṃ devasya saviturjuṣāṇā |
Translation: 4 Even he whom Aditi the Goddess praises, rejoicing in God Savitar's incitement:

Sanskit Text: अभि सम्राजो वरुणो गर्णन्त्यभि मित्रासो अर्यमा सजोषाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi samrājo varuṇo ghṛṇantyabhi mitrāso aryamā sajoṣāḥ ||
Translation: Even he who praise the high imperial Rulers, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, sing in concert.

Sanskit Text: अभि ये मिथो वनुषः सपन्ते रातिं दिवो रातिषाचः पर्थिव्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi ye mitho vanuṣaḥ sapante rātiṃ divo rātiṣācaḥ pṛthivyāḥ |
Translation: 5 They who come emulous to our oblation, dispensing bounty, from the earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: अहिर्बुध्न्य उत नः शर्णोतु वरूत्र्येकधेनुभिर्नि पातु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahirbudhnya uta naḥ śṛṇotu varūtryekadhenubhirni pātu ||
Translation: May they and Ahibudhnya hear our calling: guard us Varūtrī with the Ekadhenus.

Sanskit Text: अनु तन नो जास्पतिर्मंसीष्ट रत्नं देवस्य सवितुरियानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu tan no jāspatirmaṃsīṣṭa ratnaṃ devasya savituriyānaḥ |
Translation: 6 This may the Lord of Life, entreated, grant us,—the wealth which Savitar the God possesses.

Sanskit Text: भगमुग्रो.अवसे जोहवीति भगमनुग्रो अध याति रत्नम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhaghamughro.avase johavīti bhaghamanughro adha yāti ratnam ||
Translation: The mighty calls on Bhaga for protection, on Bhaga calls the weak to give him riches.

Sanskit Text: शं नो भवन्तु वाजिनो हवेषु देवताता मितद्रवः सवर्काः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no bhavantu vājino haveṣu devatātā mitadravaḥ svarkāḥ |
Translation: 7 Bless us the Vajins when we call, while slowly they move, strong Singers, to the Gods’ assembly.

Sanskit Text: जम्भयन्तो.अहिं वर्कं रक्षांसि सनेम्यस्मद युयवन्नमीवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jambhayanto.ahiṃ vṛkaṃ rakṣāṃsi sanemyasmad yuyavannamīvāḥ ||
Translation: Crushing the wolf, the serpent, and the demons, may they completely banish all affliction.

Sanskit Text: वाजे-वाजे.अवत वाजिनो नो धनेषु विप्रा अम्र्ता रतज्ञाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāje-vāje.avata vājino no dhaneṣu viprā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ |
Translation: 8 Deep-skilled in Law eternal, deathless, Singers, O Vajins, help us in each fray for booty.

Sanskit Text: अस्य मध्वः पिबत मादयध्वं तर्प्ता यात पथिभिर्देवयानैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya madhvaḥ pibata mādayadhvaṃ tṛptā yāta pathibhirdevayānaiḥ ||
Translation: Drink of this meath, he satisfied, be joyful: then go on paths which Gods are wont to travel.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वो अग्निः सुमतिं वस्वो अश्रेत परतीची जूर्णिर्देवतातिमेति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvo aghniḥ sumatiṃ vasvo aśret pratīcī jūrṇirdevatātimeti |
Translation: 1. AGNI, erect, hath shown enriching favour: the flame goes forward to the Gods’ assembly.

Sanskit Text: भेजाते अद्री रथ्येव पन्थां रतं होता न इषितो यजाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhejāte adrī rathyeva panthāṃ ṛtaṃ hotā na iṣito yajāti ||
Translation: Like car-borne men the stones their path have chosen: let the priest, quickened, celebrate our worship.

Sanskit Text: पर वाव्र्जे सुप्रया बर्हिरेषामा विश्पतीव बीरिट इयाते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vāvṛje suprayā barhireṣāmā viśpatīva bīriṭa iyāte |
Translation: 2 Soft to the tread, their sacred grass is scattered: these go like Kings amid the band around them,

Sanskit Text: विशामक्तोरुषसः पूर्वहूतौ वायुः पूषा सवस्तये नियुत्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśāmaktoruṣasaḥ pūrvahūtau vāyuḥ pūṣā svastaye niyutvān ||
Translation: At the folks early call on Night and Morning,—Vāyu, and Pūṣan with his team, to bless us.

Sanskit Text: जमया अत्र वसवो रन्त देवा उरावन्तरिक्षे मर्जयन्त शुभ्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jmayā atra vasavo ranta devā urāvantarikṣe marjayanta śubhrāḥ |
Translation: 3 Here on their path the noble Gods proceeded: in the wide firmament the Beauteous decked them.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाक पथ उरुज्रयः कर्णुध्वं शरोता दूतस्य जग्मुषो नो अस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāk patha urujrayaḥ kṛṇudhvaṃ śrotā dūtasya jaghmuṣo no asya ||
Translation: Bend your way hither, ye who travel widely: hear this our envoy who hath gone to meet you.

Sanskit Text: ते हि यज्ञेषु यज्ञियास ऊमाः सधस्थं विश्वे अभि सन्ति देवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te hi yajñeṣu yajñiyāsa ūmāḥ sadhasthaṃ viśve abhi santi devāḥ |
Translation: 4 For they are holy aids at sacrifices: all Gods approach the place of congregation.

Sanskit Text: तानध्वर उशतो यक्ष्यग्ने शरुष्टी भगं नासत्या पुरन्धिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tānadhvara uśato yakṣyaghne śruṣṭī bhaghaṃ nāsatyā purandhim ||
Translation: Bring these, desirous, to our worship, Agni, swift the Nisatyas, Bhaga, and Purandhi.

Sanskit Text: आग्ने गिरो दिव आ पर्थिव्या मित्रं वह वरुणमिन्द्रमग्निम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āghne ghiro diva ā pṛthivyā mitraṃ vaha varuṇamindramaghnim |
Translation: 5 Agni, to these men's hymns, from earth, from heaven, bring Mitra, Varuṇa, Indra, and Agni,

Sanskit Text: आर्यमणमदितिं विष्णुमेषां सरस्वती मरुतो मादयन्ताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āryamaṇamaditiṃ viṣṇumeṣāṃ sarasvatī maruto mādayantām ||
Translation: And Aryaman, and Aditi, and Viṣṇu. Sarasvatī be joyful, and the Maruts.

Sanskit Text: ररे हव्यं मतिभिर्यज्ञियानां नक्षत कामं मर्त्यानामसिन्वन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rare havyaṃ matibhiryajñiyānāṃ nakṣat kāmaṃ martyānāmasinvan |
Translation: 6 Even as the holy wish, the gift is offered: may he, unsated, come when men desire him.

Sanskit Text: धाता रयिमविदस्यं सदासां सक्षीमहि युज्येभिर्नु देवैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhātā rayimavidasyaṃ sadāsāṃ sakṣīmahi yujyebhirnu devaiḥ ||
Translation: Give never-failing ever-conquering riches: with Gods for our allies may we be victors.

Sanskit Text: नू रोदसी अभिष्टुते वसिष्ठैरतावानो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū rodasī abhiṣṭute vasiṣṭhairtāvāno varuṇo mitro aghniḥ |
Translation: 7 Now have both worlds been praised by the Vasisthas; and holy Mitra, Varuṇa, and Agni.

Sanskit Text: यछन्तु चन्द्रा उपमं नो अर्कं यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yachantu candrā upamaṃ no arkaṃ yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: May they, bright Deities, make our song supremest. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: परातरग्निं परातरिन्द्रं हवामहे परातर्मित्रावरुणाप्रातरश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātaraghniṃ prātarindraṃ havāmahe prātarmitrāvaruṇāprātaraśvinā |
Translation: 1. AGNI at dawn, and Indra we invoke at dawn, and Varuṇa and Mitra, and the Aśvins twain.

Sanskit Text: परातर्भगं पूषणं बरह्मणस पतिं परातः सोममुत रुद्रं हुवेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātarbhaghaṃ pūṣaṇaṃ brahmaṇas patiṃ prātaḥ somamuta rudraṃ huvema ||
Translation: Bhaga at dawn, Pūṣan, and Brahmaṇaspati, Soma at dawn, Rudra we will invoke at dawn.

Sanskit Text: परातर्जितं भगमुग्रं हुवेम वयं पुत्रमदितेर्यो विधर्ता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātarjitaṃ bhaghamughraṃ huvema vayaṃ putramaditeryo vidhartā |
Translation: 2 We will invoke strong, early-conquering Bhaga, the Son of Aditi, the great supporter:

Sanskit Text: आध्रश्चिद यं मन्यमानस्तुरश्चिद राजा चिद यं भगं भक्षीत्याह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādhraścid yaṃ manyamānasturaścid rājā cid yaṃ bhaghaṃ bhakṣītyāha ||
Translation: Thinking of whom, the poor, yea, even the mighty, even the King himself says, Give me Bhaga.

Sanskit Text: भग परणेतर्भग सत्यराधो भगेमां धियमुदवा ददन नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhagha praṇetarbhagha satyarādho bhaghemāṃ dhiyamudavā dadan naḥ |
Translation: 3 Bhaga our guide, Bhaga whose gifts are faithful, favour this song, and give us wealth, O Bhaga.

Sanskit Text: भग पर णो जनय गोभिरश्वैर्भग पर नर्भिर्न्र्वन्तः सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhagha pra ṇo janaya ghobhiraśvairbhagha pra nṛbhirnṛvantaḥ syāma ||
Translation: Bhaga, augment our store of kine and horses, Bhaga, may we be rich in men and heroes.

Sanskit Text: उतेदानीं भगवन्तः सयामोत परपित्व उत मध्ये अह्नाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: utedānīṃ bhaghavantaḥ syāmota prapitva uta madhye ahnām |
Translation: 4 So may felicity be ours at present, and when the day approaches, and at noontide;

Sanskit Text: उतोदिता मघवन सूर्यस्य वयं देवानां सुमतौ सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utoditā maghavan sūryasya vayaṃ devānāṃ sumatau syāma ||
Translation: And may we still, O Bounteous One, at sunset be happy in the Deities' loving-kindness.

Sanskit Text: भग एव भगवानस्तु देवास्तेन वयं भगवन्तः सयाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhagha eva bhaghavānastu devāstena vayaṃ bhaghavantaḥ syāma |
Translation: 5 May Bhaga verily be bliss-bestower, and through him, Gods! may happiness attend us.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा भग सर्व इज्जोहवीति स नो भग पुरेता भवेह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā bhagha sarva ijjohavīti sa no bhagha puraetā bhaveha ||
Translation: As such, O Bhaga, all with might invoke thee: as such be thou our Champion here, O Bhaga.

Sanskit Text: समध्वरायोषसो नमन्त दधिक्रावेव शुचये पदाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samadhvarāyoṣaso namanta dadhikrāveva śucaye padāya |
Translation: 6 To this our worship may all Dawns incline them, and come to the pure place like Dadhikrāvan.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाचीनं वसुविदं भगं नो रथमिवाश्वा वाजिन आ वहन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvācīnaṃ vasuvidaṃ bhaghaṃ no rathamivāśvā vājina ā vahantu ||
Translation: As strong steeds draw a chariot may they bring us hitherward Bhaga who discovers treasure.

Sanskit Text: अश्वावतीर्गोमतीर्न उषासो वीरवतीः सदमुछन्तु भद्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvāvatīrghomatīrna uṣāso vīravatīḥ sadamuchantu bhadrāḥ |
Translation: 7 May blessed Mornings dawn on us for ever, with wealth of kine, of horses, and of heroes,

Sanskit Text: घर्तं दुहाना विश्वतः परपीता यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtaṃ duhānā viśvataḥ prapītā yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Streaming with all abundance, pouring fatness. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: पर बरह्माणो अङगिरसो नक्षन्त पर करन्दनुर्नभन्यस्य वेतु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra brahmāṇo aṅghiraso nakṣanta pra krandanurnabhanyasya vetu |
Translation: 1. LET Brahmans and Aṅgirases come forward, and let the roar of cloudy heaven surround us.

Sanskit Text: पर धेनव उदप्रुतो नवन्त युज्यातामद्री अध्वरस्य पेशः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra dhenava udapruto navanta yujyātāmadrī adhvarasya peśaḥ ||
Translation: Loud low the Milch-kine swimming in the waters: set be the stones that grace our holy service.

Sanskit Text: सुगस्ते अग्ने सनवित्तो अध्वा युक्ष्वा सुते हरितो रोहितश्च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sughaste aghne sanavitto adhvā yukṣvā sute harito rohitaśca |
Translation: 2 Fair, Agni, is thy long-known path to travel: yoke for the juice tfiy bay, thy ruddy horses,

Sanskit Text: ये वा सद्मन्नरुषा वीरवाहो हुवे देवानां जनिमानिसत्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye vā sadmannaruṣā vīravāho huve devānāṃ janimānisattaḥ ||
Translation: Or red steeds, Hero-bearing, for the chamber. Seated, I call the Deities' generations.

Sanskit Text: समु वो यज्ञं महयन नमोभिः पर होता मन्द्रो रिरिच उपाके |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samu vo yajñaṃ mahayan namobhiḥ pra hotā mandro ririca upāke |
Translation: 3 They glorify your sacrifice with worship, yet the glad Priest near them is left unequalled.

Sanskit Text: यजस्व सु पुर्वणीक देवाना यज्ञियामरमतिं वव्र्त्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajasva su purvaṇīka devānā yajñiyāmaramatiṃ vavṛtyāḥ ||
Translation: Bring the Gods hither, thou of many aspects: turn hitherward Aramati the Holy.

Sanskit Text: यदा वीरस्य रेवतो दुरोणे सयोनशीरतिथिराचिकेतत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā vīrasya revato duroṇe syonaśīratithirāciketat |
Translation: 4 What time the Guest hath made himself apparent, at ease reclining in the rich man's dwelling,

Sanskit Text: सुप्रीतो अग्निः सुधितो दम आ स विशे दाति वार्यमियत्यै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suprīto aghniḥ sudhito dama ā sa viśe dāti vāryamiyatyai ||
Translation: Agni, well-pleased, well-placed within the chamber gives to a house like this wealth worth the choosing.

Sanskit Text: इमं नो अग्ने अध्वरं जुषस्व मरुत्स्विन्द्रे यशसं कर्धी नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ no aghne adhvaraṃ juṣasva marutsvindre yaśasaṃ kṛdhī naḥ |
Translation: 5 Accept this sacrifice of ours, O Agni; glorify it with Indra and the Maruts.

Sanskit Text: आ नक्ता बर्हिः सदतामुषासोशन्ता मित्रावरुणायजेह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā naktā barhiḥ sadatāmuṣāsośantā mitrāvaruṇāyajeha ||
Translation: Here on our grass let Night and Dawn be seated: bring longing Varuṇa and Mitra hither.

Sanskit Text: एवाग्निं सहस्यं वसिष्ठो रायस्कामो विश्वप्स्न्यस्य सतौत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evāghniṃ sahasyaṃ vasiṣṭho rāyaskāmo viśvapsnyasya staut |
Translation: 6 Thus hath Vasiṣṭha praised victorious Agni, yearning for wealth that giveth all subsistence.

Sanskit Text: इषं रयिं पप्रथद वाजमस्मे यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣaṃ rayiṃ paprathad vājamasme yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: May he bestow on us food, strength, and riches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: पर वो यज्ञेषु देवयन्तो अर्चन दयावा नमोभिः परिथिवी इषध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vo yajñeṣu devayanto arcan dyāvā namobhiḥ prithivī iṣadhyai |
Translation: 1. SING out the pious at your sacrifices to move with adorations Earth and Heaven-

Sanskit Text: येषां बरह्माण्यसमानि विप्रा विष्वग वियन्ति वनिनो न शाखाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yeṣāṃ brahmāṇyasamāni viprā viṣvagh viyanti vanino na śākhāḥ ||
Translation: The Holy Singers, whose unmatched devotions, like a tree's branches, part in all directions.

Sanskit Text: पर यज्ञ एतु हेत्वो न सप्तिरुद यछध्वं समनसो घर्ताचीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yajña etu hetvo na saptirud yachadhvaṃ samanaso ghṛtācīḥ |
Translation: 2 Let sacrifice proceed like some fleet courser: with one accord lift ye on high the ladles.

Sanskit Text: सत्र्णीत बर्हिरध्वराय साधूर्ध्वा शोचींषि देवयून्यस्थुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stṛṇīta barhiradhvarāya sādhūrdhvā śocīṃṣi devayūnyasthuḥ ||
Translation: Strew sacred grass meet for the solenm service: bright flames that love the Gods have mounted upward.

Sanskit Text: आ पुत्रासो न मातरं विभ्र्त्राः सानौ देवासो बर्हिषःसदन्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā putrāso na mātaraṃ vibhṛtrāḥ sānau devāso barhiṣaḥsadantu |
Translation: 3 Like babes in arms reposing on their mother, let the Gods sit upon the grass's summit.

Sanskit Text: आ विश्वाची विदथ्यामनक्त्वग्ने मा नो देवताता मर्धस कः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā viśvācī vidathyāmanaktvaghne mā no devatātā mṛdhas kaḥ ||
Translation: Let general fire make bright the flame of worship: scorn us not, Agni, in the Gods’ assembly.

Sanskit Text: ते सीषपन्त जोषमा यजत्रा रतस्य धाराः सुदुघा दुहानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te sīṣapanta joṣamā yajatrā ṛtasya dhārāḥ sudughā duhānāḥ |
Translation: 4 Gladly the Gods have let themselves be honoured, milking the copious streams of holy Order.

Sanskit Text: जयेष्ठं वो अद्य मह आ वसूनामा गन्तन समनसो यति षठ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyeṣṭhaṃ vo adya maha ā vasūnāmā ghantana samanaso yati ṣṭha ||
Translation: The highest might to-day is yours, the Vasits': come ye, as many as ye are, one-minded.

Sanskit Text: एवा नो अग्ने विक्ष्वा दशस्य तवया वयं सहसावन्नास्क्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā no aghne vikṣvā daśasya tvayā vayaṃ sahasāvannāskrāḥ |
Translation: 5 So, Agni, send us wealth among the people: may we be closely knit to thee, O Victor,

Sanskit Text: राया युजा सधमादो अरिष्टा यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyā yujā sadhamādo ariṣṭā yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Unharmed, and rich, and taking joy together. Preserve us evermore, ye ods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: दधिक्रां वः परथममश्विनोषसमग्निं समिद्धं भगमूतये हुवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhikrāṃ vaḥ prathamamaśvinoṣasamaghniṃ samiddhaṃ bhaghamūtaye huve |
Translation: 1. I CALL on Dadhikrās, the first, to give you aid, the Aśvins, Bhaga, Dawn, and Agni kindled well,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं विष्णुं पूषणं बरह्मणस पतिमादित्यान दयावाप्र्थिवी अपः सवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ viṣṇuṃ pūṣaṇaṃ brahmaṇas patimādityān dyāvāpṛthivī apaḥ svaḥ ||
Translation: Indra, and Viṣṇu, Pūṣan, Brahmaṇaspati, Ādityas, Heaven and Earth, the Waters, and the Light.

Sanskit Text: दधिक्रामु नमसा बोधयन्त उदीराणा यज्ञमुपप्रयन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhikrāmu namasā bodhayanta udīrāṇā yajñamupaprayantaḥ |
Translation: 2 When, rising, to the sacrifice we hasten, awaking Dadhikrās with adorations.

Sanskit Text: इळां देवीं बर्हिषि सादयन्तो.अश्विना विप्रा सुहवाहुवेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iḷāṃ devīṃ barhiṣi sādayanto.aśvinā viprā suhavāhuvema ||
Translation: Seating on sacred grass the Goddess Iḷā. let us invoke the sage swift-hearing Aśvins.

Sanskit Text: दधिक्रावाणं बुबुधानो अग्निमुप बरुव उषसं सूर्यं गाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhikrāvāṇaṃ bubudhāno aghnimupa bruva uṣasaṃ sūryaṃ ghām |
Translation: 3 While I am thus arousing Dadhikrāvan I speak to Agni, Earth, and Dawn, and Sūrya,

Sanskit Text: बरध्नं मांश्चतोर्वरुणस्य बभ्रुं ते विश्वास्मद दुरिता यावयन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bradhnaṃ māṃścatorvaruṇasya babhruṃ te viśvāsmad duritā yāvayantu ||
Translation: The red, the brown of Varuṇa ever mindful: may they ward off from us all grief and trouble.

Sanskit Text: दधिक्रावा परथमो वाज्यर्वाग्रे रथानां भवति परजानन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhikrāvā prathamo vājyarvāghre rathānāṃ bhavati prajānan |
Translation: 4 Foremost is Dadhikrāvan, vigorous courser; in forefront of the cars, his way he knoweth,

Sanskit Text: संविदान उषसा सूर्येणादित्येभिर्वसुभिरङगिरोभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃvidāna uṣasā sūryeṇādityebhirvasubhiraṅghirobhiḥ ||
Translation: Closely allied with Sūrya and with Morning, Ādityas, and Aṅgirases, and Vasus.

Sanskit Text: आ नो दधिक्राः पथ्यामनक्त्व रतस्य पन्थामन्वेतवा उ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no dadhikrāḥ pathyāmanaktv ṛtasya panthāmanvetavā u |
Translation: 5 May Dadhikrās prepare the way we travel that we may pass along the path of Order.

Sanskit Text: शर्णोतु नो दैव्यं शर्धो अग्निः शर्ण्वन्तु विश्वे महिषामूराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇotu no daivyaṃ śardho aghniḥ śṛṇvantu viśve mahiṣāamūrāḥ ||
Translation: May Agni bear us, and the Heavenly Army: hear us all Mighty Ones whom none deceiveth.

Sanskit Text: आ देवो यातु सविता सुरत्नो.अन्तरिक्षप्रा वहमानो अश्वैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā devo yātu savitā suratno.antarikṣaprā vahamāno aśvaiḥ |
Translation: 1. MAY the God Savitar, rich in goodly treasures, filling the region, borne by steeds, come hither,

Sanskit Text: हस्ते दधानो नर्या पुरूणि निवेशयञ्च परसुवञ्च भूम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: haste dadhāno naryā purūṇi niveśayañca prasuvañca bhūma ||
Translation: In his hand holding much that makes men happy, lulling to slumber and arousing creatures.

Sanskit Text: उदस्य बाहू शिथिरा बर्हन्ता हिरण्यया दिवो अन्ताननष्टाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udasya bāhū śithirā bṛhantā hiraṇyayā divo antānanaṣṭām |
Translation: 2 Golden, sublime, and easy in their motion, his arms extend unto the bounds of heaven.

Sanskit Text: नूनं सो अस्य महिमा पनिष्ट सूरश्चिदस्मा अनु दादपस्याम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nūnaṃ so asya mahimā paniṣṭa sūraścidasmā anu dādapasyām ||
Translation: Now shall that mightiness of his he lauded: even Sūrya yields to him in active vigour.

Sanskit Text: स घा नो देवः सविता सहावा साविषद वसुपतिर्वसूनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ghā no devaḥ savitā sahāvā sāviṣad vasupatirvasūni |
Translation: 3 May this God Savitar, the Strong and Mighty, the Lord of precious wealth, vouchsafe us treasures.

Sanskit Text: विश्रयमाणो अमतिमुरूचीं मर्तभोजनमध रासते नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśrayamāṇo amatimurūcīṃ martabhojanamadha rāsate naḥ ||
Translation: May he, advancing his far-spreading lustre, bestow on us the food that feedeth mortals.

Sanskit Text: इमा गिरः सवितारं सुजिह्वं पूर्णगभस्तिमीळते सुपाणिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā ghiraḥ savitāraṃ sujihvaṃ pūrṇaghabhastimīḷate supāṇim |
Translation: 4 These songs praise Savitar whose tongue is pleasant, praise him whose arms are full, whose hands are lovely.

Sanskit Text: चित्रं वयो बर्हदस्मे दधातु यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: citraṃ vayo bṛhadasme dadhātu yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: High vital strength, and manifold, may he grant us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: इमा रुद्राय सथिरधन्वने गिरः कषिप्रेषवे देवाय सवधाव्ने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā rudrāya sthiradhanvane ghiraḥ kṣipreṣave devāya svadhāvne |
Translation: 1. To Rudra bring these songs, whose bow is firm and strong, the self-dependent God with swiftly-flying shafts,

Sanskit Text: अषाळ्हाय सहमानाय वेधसे तिग्मायुधाय भरता शर्णोतु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṣāḷhāya sahamānāya vedhase tighmāyudhāya bharatā śṛṇotu naḥ ||
Translation: The Wise, the Conqueror whom none may overcome, armed with sharp-pointed weapons: may he hear our call.

Sanskit Text: स हि कषयेण कषम्यस्य जन्मनः साम्राज्येन दिव्यस्य चेतति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi kṣayeṇa kṣamyasya janmanaḥ sāmrājyena divyasya cetati |
Translation: 2 He through his lordship thinks on beings of the earth, on heavenly beings through his high imperial sway.

Sanskit Text: अवन्नवन्तीरुप नो दुरश्चरानमीवो रुद्र जासु नो भव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avannavantīrupa no duraścarānamīvo rudra jāsu no bhava ||
Translation: Come willingly to our doors that gladly welcome thee, and heal all sickness, Rudra., in our families.

Sanskit Text: या ते दिद्युदवस्र्ष्टा दिवस परि कष्मया चरति परि साव्र्णक्तु नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā te didyudavasṛṣṭā divas pari kṣmayā carati pari sāvṛṇaktu naḥ |
Translation: 3 May thy bright arrow which, shot down by thee from heaven, flieth upon the earth, pass us uninjured by.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रं ते सवपिवात भेषजा मा नस्तोकेषुतनयेषु रीरिषह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasraṃ te svapivāta bheṣajā mā nastokeṣutanayeṣu rīriṣah ||
Translation: Thou, very gracious God, hast thousand medicines: inflict no evil on our sons or progeny.

Sanskit Text: मा नो वधी रुद्र मा परा दा मा ते भूम परसितौ हीळितस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no vadhī rudra mā parā dā mā te bhūma prasitau hīḷitasya |
Translation: 4 Slay us not, nor abandon us, O Rudra let not thy noose, when thou art angry, seize us.

Sanskit Text: आ नो भज बर्हिषि जीवशंसे यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no bhaja barhiṣi jīvaśaṃse yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Give us trimmed grass and fame among the living. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: आपो यं वः परथमं देवयन्त इन्द्रपानमूर्मिमक्र्ण्वतेळः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpo yaṃ vaḥ prathamaṃ devayanta indrapānamūrmimakṛṇvateḷaḥ |
Translation: 1. MAY we obtain this day from you, O Waters, that wave of pure refreshment, which the pious

Sanskit Text: तं वो वयं शुचिमरिप्रमद्य घर्तप्रुषं मधुमन्तं वनेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vo vayaṃ śucimaripramadya ghṛtapruṣaṃ madhumantaṃ vanema ||
Translation: Made erst the special beverage of Indra, bright, stainless, rich in sweets and dropping fatness.

Sanskit Text: तमूर्मिमापो मधुमत्तमं वो.अपां नपादवत्वाशुहेमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamūrmimāpo madhumattamaṃ vo.apāṃ napādavatvāśuhemā |
Translation: 2 May the Floods' Offspring, he whose course is rapid, protect that wave most rich in sweets, O Waters,

Sanskit Text: यस्मिन्निन्द्रो वसुभिर्मादयाते तमश्याम देवयन्तो वो अद्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasminnindro vasubhirmādayāte tamaśyāma devayanto vo adya ||
Translation: That shall make Indra and the Vasus joyful. This may we gain from you to-day, we pious.

Sanskit Text: शतपवित्राः सवधया मदन्तीर्देवीर्देवानामपि यन्ति पाथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śatapavitrāḥ svadhayā madantīrdevīrdevānāmapi yanti pāthaḥ |
Translation: 3 All-purifying, joying in their nature, to paths of Gods the Goddesses move onward.

Sanskit Text: ता इन्द्रस्य न मिनन्ति वरतानि सिन्धुभ्यो हव्यं घर्तवज्जुहोत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā indrasya na minanti vratāni sindhubhyo havyaṃ ghṛtavajjuhota ||
Translation: They never violate the laws of Indra. Present the oil-rich offering to the Rivers.

Sanskit Text: याः सूर्यो रश्मिभिराततान याभ्य इन्द्रो अरदद गातुमूर्मिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāḥ sūryo raśmibhirātatāna yābhya indro aradad ghātumūrmim |
Translation: 4 Whom Sūrya with his bright beams hath attracted, and Indra dug the path for them to travel,

Sanskit Text: ते सिन्धवो वरिवो धातना नो यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te sindhavo varivo dhātanā no yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: May these Streams give us ample room and freedom. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: रभुक्षणो वाजा मादयध्वमस्मे नरो मघवानः सुतस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛbhukṣaṇo vājā mādayadhvamasme naro maghavānaḥ sutasya |
Translation: 1. YE liberal Heroes, Vājas and Ṛbhukṣans, come and delight you with our flowing Soma.

Sanskit Text: आ वो.अर्वाचः करतवो न यातां विभ्वो रथं नर्यं वर्तयन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vo.arvācaḥ kratavo na yātāṃ vibhvo rathaṃ naryaṃ vartayantu ||
Translation: May your strength, Vibhus, as ye come to meet us, turn hitherward your car that brings men profit.

Sanskit Text: रभुरभुभिरभि वः सयाम विभ्वो विभुभिः शवसा शवांसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛbhurbhubhirabhi vaḥ syāma vibhvo vibhubhiḥ śavasā śavāṃsi |
Translation: 2 May we as Ṛbhu with your Ṛbhus conquer strength with our strength, as Vibhus with the Vibhus.

Sanskit Text: वाजो अस्मानवतु वाजसाताविन्द्रेण युजा तरुषेमव्र्त्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājo asmānavatu vājasātāvindreṇa yujā taruṣemavṛtram ||
Translation: May Vāja aid us in the fight for booty, and helped by Indra may we quell the foeman.

Sanskit Text: ते चिद धि पूर्वीरभि सन्ति शासा विश्वानर्य उपरताति वन्वन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te cid dhi pūrvīrabhi santi śāsā viśvānarya uparatāti vanvan |
Translation: 3 For they rule many tribes with high dominion, and conquer all their foes in close encounter.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो विभ्वान रभुक्षा वाजो अर्यः शत्रोर्मिथत्या कर्णवन वि नर्म्णम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro vibhvān ṛbhukṣā vājo aryaḥ śatrormithatyā kṛṇavan vi nṛmṇam ||
Translation: May Indra, Vibhvan, Vāja, and Ṛbhukṣan destroy by turns the wicked foeman's valour.

Sanskit Text: नू देवासो वरिवः कर्तना नो भूत नो विश्वे.अवसे सजोषाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū devāso varivaḥ kartanā no bhūta no viśve.avase sajoṣāḥ |
Translation: 4 Now, Deities, give us ample room and freedom: be all of you, one-minded, our protection.

Sanskit Text: समस्मे इषं वसवो ददीरन यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samasme iṣaṃ vasavo dadīran yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: So let the Vasus grant us strength and vigour. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: समुद्रज्येष्ठाः सलिलस्य मध्यात पुनाना यन्त्यनिविशमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samudrajyeṣṭhāḥ salilasya madhyāt punānā yantyaniviśamānāḥ |
Translation: 1. FORTH from the middle of the flood the Waters-their chief the Sea-flow cleansing, never sleeping.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो या वज्री वर्षभो रराद ता आपो देवीरिहमामवन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro yā vajrī vṛṣabho rarāda tā āpo devīrihamāmavantu ||
Translation: Indra, the Bull, the Thunderer, dug their channels: here let those Waters, Goddesses, protect me.

Sanskit Text: या आपो दिव्या उत वा सरवन्ति खनित्रिमा उत वा याः सवयंजाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā āpo divyā uta vā sravanti khanitrimā uta vā yāḥ svayaṃjāḥ |
Translation: 2 Waters which come from heaven, or those that wander dug from the earth, or flowing free by nature,

Sanskit Text: समुद्रार्था याः शुचयः पावकास्ता आपो .. . ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samudrārthā yāḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāstā āpo .. . ||
Translation: Bright, purifying, speeding to the Ocean, here let those Waters. Goddesses, protect me.

Sanskit Text: यासां राजा वरुणो याति मध्ये सत्यान्र्ते अवपश्यञ जनानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāsāṃ rājā varuṇo yāti madhye satyānṛte avapaśyañ janānām |
Translation: 3 Those amid whom goes Varuṇa the Sovran, he who discriminates men's truth and falsehood-

Sanskit Text: मधुश्चुतः शुचयो याः पावकास्ता आपो ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhuścutaḥ śucayo yāḥ pāvakāstā āpo ... ||
Translation: Distilling meath, the bright, the purifying, here let those Waters, Goddesses, protect me.

Sanskit Text: यासु राजा वरुणो यासु सोमो विश्वे देवा यासूर्जं मदन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāsu rājā varuṇo yāsu somo viśve devā yāsūrjaṃ madanti |
Translation: 4 They from whom Varuṇa the King, and Soma, and all the Deities drink strength and vigour,

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानरो यास्वग्निः परविष्टस्ता आपो ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānaro yāsvaghniḥ praviṣṭastā āpo ... ||
Translation: They into whom Vaiśvānara Agni entered, here let those Waters, Goddesses, protect Me.

Sanskit Text: आ मां मित्रावरुणेह रक्षतं कुलाययद विश्वयन मा न आ गन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā māṃ mitrāvaruṇeha rakṣataṃ kulāyayad viśvayan mā na ā ghan |
Translation: 1. O MITRA-VARUNA, guard and protect me here: let not that come to me which nests within and swells.

Sanskit Text: अजकावं दुर्द्र्शीकं तिरो दधे मा मां पद्येन रपसा विदत तसरुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajakāvaṃ durdṛśīkaṃ tiro dadhe mā māṃ padyena rapasā vidat tsaruḥ ||
Translation: I drive afar the scorpion hateful to the sight: let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.

Sanskit Text: यद विजामन परुषि वन्दनं भुवदष्ठीवन्तौ परि कुल्फौ च देहत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vijāman paruṣi vandanaṃ bhuvadaṣṭhīvantau pari kulphau ca dehat |
Translation: 2 Eruption that appears upon the twofold joints, and that which overspreads the ankles and the knees,

Sanskit Text: अग्निष टच्छोचन्नप बाधतामितो मा माम्पद्येन ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṣ ṭacchocannapa bādhatāmito mā māmpadyena ... ||
Translation: May the refulgent Agni banish far away let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.

Sanskit Text: यच्छल्मलौ भवति यन नदीषु यदोषधीभ्यः परि जायते विषम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yacchalmalau bhavati yan nadīṣu yadoṣadhībhyaḥ pari jāyate viṣam |
Translation: 3 The poison that is formed upon the Salmali, that which is found in streams, that which the plants produce,

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवा निरितस्तत सुवन्तु मा मां पद्येन ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devā niritastat suvantu mā māṃ padyena ... ||
Translation: All this may all the Gods banish and drive away: let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.

Sanskit Text: याः परवतो निवत उद्वत उदन्वतीरनुदकाश्च याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāḥ pravato nivata udvata udanvatīranudakāśca yāḥ |
Translation: 4 The steep declivities, the valleys, and the heights, the channels full of water, and the waterless-

Sanskit Text: ता अस्मभ्यं पयसा पिन्वमानाः शिवा देवीरशिपदा भवन्तु सर्वा नद्यो अशिमिदा भवन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā asmabhyaṃ payasā pinvamānāḥ śivā devīraśipadā bhavantu sarvā nadyo aśimidā bhavantu ||
Translation: May those who swell with water, gracious Goddesses, never afflict us with the Sipada disease, may all the rivers keep us free from Simida.

Sanskit Text: आदित्यानामवसा नूतनेन सक्षीमहि शर्मणा शन्तमेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityānāmavasā nūtanena sakṣīmahi śarmaṇā śantamena |
Translation: 1 THROUGH the Ādityas’ most auspicious shelter, through their most recent succour may we conquer.

Sanskit Text: अनागास्त्वे अदितित्वे तुरास इमं यज्ञं दधतु शरोषमाणाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anāghāstve adititve turāsa imaṃ yajñaṃ dadhatu śroṣamāṇāḥ ||
Translation: May they, the Mighty, giving ear, establish this sacrifice, to make us free and sinless.

Sanskit Text: आदित्यासो अदितिर्मादयन्तां मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणो रजिष्ठाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityāso aditirmādayantāṃ mitro aryamā varuṇo rajiṣṭhāḥ |
Translation: 2 Let Aditi rejoice and the Ādityas, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, most righteous.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकं सन्तु भुवनस्य गोपाः पिबन्तु सोममवसे नो अद्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākaṃ santu bhuvanasya ghopāḥ pibantu somamavase no adya ||
Translation: May they, the Guardians of the world, protect us, and, to show favour, drink this day our Soma.

Sanskit Text: आदित्या विश्वे मरुतश्च विश्वे देवाश्च विश्व रभवश्च विश्वे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityā viśve marutaśca viśve devāśca viśva ṛbhavaśca viśve |
Translation: 3 All Universal Deities, the Maruts, all the Ādityas, yea, and all the Ṛbhus,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो अग्निरश्विना तुष्टुवाना यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro aghniraśvinā tuṣṭuvānā yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Indra, and Agni, and the Aśvins, lauded. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: आदित्यासो अदितयः सयाम पूर्देवत्रा वसवो मर्त्यत्रा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityāso aditayaḥ syāma pūrdevatrā vasavo martyatrā |
Translation: 1. MAY we be free from every bond, Ādityas! a castle among Gods and men, ye Vasus.

Sanskit Text: सनेम मित्रावरुणा सनन्तो भवेम दयावाप्र्थिवी भवन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanema mitrāvaruṇā sananto bhavema dyāvāpṛthivī bhavantaḥ ||
Translation: Winning, may we win Varuṇa and Mitra, and, being, may we be, O Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: मित्रस्तन नो वरुणो मामहन्त शर्म तोकाय तनयाय गोपाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitrastan no varuṇo māmahanta śarma tokāya tanayāya ghopāḥ |
Translation: 2 May Varuṇa and Mitra grant this blessing, our Guardians, shelter to our seed and offspring.

Sanskit Text: मा वो भुजेमान्यजातमेनो मा तत कर्म वसवो यच्चयध्वे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā vo bhujemānyajātameno mā tat karma vasavo yaccayadhve ||
Translation: Let us not suffer for another's trespass. nor do the thing that ye, O Vasus, punish.

Sanskit Text: तुरण्यवो.अङगिरसो नक्षन्त रत्नं देवस्य सवितुरियानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: turaṇyavo.aṅghiraso nakṣanta ratnaṃ devasya savituriyānāḥ |
Translation: 3 The ever-prompt Aṅgirases, imploring riches from Savitar the God, obtained them.

Sanskit Text: पिता च तन नो महान यजत्रो विश्वे देवाः समनसो जुषन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pitā ca tan no mahān yajatro viśve devāḥ samanaso juṣanta ||
Translation: So may our Father who is great and holy, and all the Gods, accordant, grant this favour.

Sanskit Text: पर दयावा यज्ञैः पर्थिवी नमोभिः सबाध ईळे बर्हतीयजत्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra dyāvā yajñaiḥ pṛthivī namobhiḥ sabādha īḷe bṛhatīyajatre |
Translation: 1. AS priest with solemn rites and adorations I worship Heaven and Earth, the High and Holy.

Sanskit Text: ते चिद धि पूर्वे कवयो गर्णन्तः पुरो मही दधिरे देवपुत्रे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te cid dhi pūrve kavayo ghṛṇantaḥ puro mahī dadhire devaputre ||
Translation: To them, great Parents of the Gods, have sages of ancient time, singing, assigned precedence.

Sanskit Text: पर पूर्वजे पितरा नव्यसीभिर्गीर्भिः कर्णुध्वं सदने रतस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra pūrvaje pitarā navyasībhirghīrbhiḥ kṛṇudhvaṃ sadane ṛtasya |
Translation: 2 With newest hymns set in the seat of Order, those the Two Parents, born before all others,

Sanskit Text: आ नो दयावाप्र्थिवी दैव्येन जनेन यातं महि वां वरूथम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no dyāvāpṛthivī daivyena janena yātaṃ mahi vāṃ varūtham ||
Translation: Come, Heaven and Earth, with the Celestial People, hither to us, for strong is your protection.

Sanskit Text: उतो हि वां रत्नधेयानि सन्ति पुरूणि दयावाप्र्थिवी सुदासे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto hi vāṃ ratnadheyāni santi purūṇi dyāvāpṛthivī sudāse |
Translation: 3 Yea, Heaven and Earth, ye hold in your possession full many a treasure for the liberal giver.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे धत्तं यदसदस्क्र्धोयु यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme dhattaṃ yadasadaskṛdhoyu yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Grant us that wealth which comes in free abundance. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: वास्तोष पते परति जानीह्यस्मान सवावेशो अनमीवो भवा नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāstoṣ pate prati jānīhyasmān svāveśo anamīvo bhavā naḥ |
Translation: 1. ACKNOWLEDGE us, O Guardian of the Homestead: bring no disease, and give us happy entrance.

Sanskit Text: यत तवेमहे परति तन नो जुषस्व शं नो भव दविपदे शं चतुष्पदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat tvemahe prati tan no juṣasva śaṃ no bhava dvipade śaṃ catuṣpade ||
Translation: Whate’er we ask of thee, be pleased to grant it, and prosper thou quadrupeds and bipeds.

Sanskit Text: वास्तोष पते परतरणो न एधि गयस्फानो गोभिरश्वेभिरिन्दो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāstoṣ pate prataraṇo na edhi ghayasphāno ghobhiraśvebhirindo |
Translation: 2 Protector of the Home, be our promoter: increase our wealth in kine and steeds, O Indu.

Sanskit Text: अजरासस्ते सख्ये सयाम पितेव पुत्रान परति नो जुषस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajarāsaste sakhye syāma piteva putrān prati no juṣasva ||
Translation: May we be ever-youthful in thy friendship: be pleased in us as in his sons a father.

Sanskit Text: वास्तोष पते शग्मया संसदा ते सक्षीमहि रण्वया गातुमत्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāstoṣ pate śaghmayā saṃsadā te sakṣīmahi raṇvayā ghātumatyā |
Translation: 3 Through thy dear fellowship that bringeth welfare, may we be victors, Guardian of the Dwelling!

Sanskit Text: पाहि कषेम उत योगे वरं नो यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāhi kṣema uta yoghe varaṃ no yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
