Translation: Protect our happiness in rest and labour. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: अमीवहा वास्तोष पते विश्वा रूपाण्याविशन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: amīvahā vāstoṣ pate viśvā rūpāṇyāviśan |
Translation: 1. VASTOSPATI, who killest all disease and wearest every form,

Sanskit Text: सखा सुशेव एधि नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhā suśeva edhi naḥ ||
Translation: Be an auspicious Friend to us.

Sanskit Text: यदर्जुन सारमेय दतः पिशङग यछसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadarjuna sārameya dataḥ piśaṅgha yachase |
Translation: 2 When, O bright Son of Saramā, thou showest, tawny-hued! thy teeth,

Sanskit Text: वीव भराजन्त रष्टय उप सरक्वेषु बप्सतो नि षु सवप ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vīva bhrājanta ṛṣṭaya upa srakveṣu bapsato ni ṣu svapa ||
Translation: They gleam like lances' points within thy mouth when thou wouldst bite; go thou to steep.

Sanskit Text: सतेनं राय सारमेय तस्करं वा पुनःसर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stenaṃ rāya sārameya taskaraṃ vā punaḥsara |
Translation: 3 Saramā's Son, retrace thy way: bark at the robber and the thief.

Sanskit Text: सतोतॄनिन्द्रस्य रायसि किमस्मान दुछुनायसे नि षु सवप ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stotṝnindrasya rāyasi kimasmān duchunāyase ni ṣu svapa ||
Translation: At Indra's singers barkest thou? Why dust thou seek to terrify us? Go to sleep.

Sanskit Text: तवं सूकरस्य दर्द्र्हि तव दर्दर्तु सूकरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ sūkarasya dardṛhi tava dardartu sūkaraḥ |
Translation: 4 Be on thy guard against the boar, and let the boar beware of thee.

Sanskit Text: सतोतॄनिन्द्रस्य ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stotṝnindrasya ... ||
Translation: At Indra's singers barkest thou? Why dost thou seek to terrify us? Go to sleep.

Sanskit Text: सस्तु माता सस्तु पिता सस्तु शवा सस्तु विश्पतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sastu mātā sastu pitā sastu śvā sastu viśpatiḥ |
Translation: 5 Sleep mother, let the father sleep, sleep dog and master of the house.

Sanskit Text: ससन्तु सर्वे जञातयः सस्त्वयमभितो जनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sasantu sarve jñātayaḥ sastvayamabhito janaḥ ||
Translation: Let all the kinsmen sleep, sleep all the people who are round about.

Sanskit Text: य आस्ते यश्च चरति यश्च पश्यति नो जनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya āste yaśca carati yaśca paśyati no janaḥ |
Translation: 6 The man who sits, the man who walks, and whosoever looks on us,

Sanskit Text: तेषांसं हन्मो अक्षाणि यथेदं हर्म्यं तथा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: teṣāṃsaṃ hanmo akṣāṇi yathedaṃ harmyaṃ tathā ||
Translation: Of these we closely shut the eyes, even as we closely shut this house.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रश्र्ङगो वर्षभो यः समुद्रादुदाचरत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasraśṛṅgho vṛṣabho yaḥ samudrādudācarat |
Translation: 7 The Bull who hath a thousand horns, who rises up from out the sea,—

Sanskit Text: तेना सहस्येना वयं नि जनान सवापयामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tenā sahasyenā vayaṃ ni janān svāpayāmasi ||
Translation: By him the Strong and Mighty One we lull and make the people sleep.

Sanskit Text: परोष्ठशया वह्येशया नारीर्यास्तल्पशीवरीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: proṣṭhaśayā vahyeśayā nārīryāstalpaśīvarīḥ |
Translation: 8 The women sleeping in the court, lying without, or stretched on beds,

Sanskit Text: सत्रियो याः पुण्यगन्धास्ताः सर्वाः सवापयामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: striyo yāḥ puṇyaghandhāstāḥ sarvāḥ svāpayāmasi ||
Translation: The matrons with their odorous sweetsthese, one and all, we lull to sleep.

Sanskit Text: क ईं वयक्ता नरः सनीळा रुद्रस्य मर्या अध सवश्वाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ka īṃ vyaktā naraḥ sanīḷā rudrasya maryā adha svaśvāḥ ||
Translation: 1. Wno are these radiant men in serried rank, Rudra's young heroes borne by noble steeds?

Sanskit Text: नकिर्ह्येषां जनूंषि वेद ते अङग विद्रे मिथो जनित्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nakirhyeṣāṃ janūṃṣi veda te aṅgha vidre mitho janitram ||
Translation: 2 Verily no one knoweth whence they sprang: they, and they only, know each other's birth.

Sanskit Text: अभि सवपूभिर्मिथो वपन्त वातस्वनसः शयेना अस्प्र्ध्रन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi svapūbhirmitho vapanta vātasvanasaḥ śyenā aspṛdhran ||
Translation: 3 They strew each other with their blasts, these Hawks: they strove together, roaring like the wind.

Sanskit Text: एतानि धीरो निण्या चिकेत पर्श्निर्यदूधो मही जभार ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: etāni dhīro niṇyā ciketa pṛśniryadūdho mahī jabhāra ||
Translation: 4 A sage was he who knew these mysteries, what in her udder mighty Pṛśni bore.

Sanskit Text: सा विट सुवीरा मरुद्भिरस्तु सनात सहन्ती पुष्यन्ती नर्म्णम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā viṭ suvīrā marudbhirastu sanāt sahantī puṣyantī nṛmṇam ||
Translation: 5 Ever victorious, through the Maruts, be this band of Heroes, nursing manly strength,

Sanskit Text: यामं येष्ठाः शुभा शोभिष्ठाः शरिया सम्मिश्ला ओजोभिरुग्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāmaṃ yeṣṭhāḥ śubhā śobhiṣṭhāḥ śriyā sammiślā ojobhirughrāḥ ||
Translation: 6 Most bright in splendour, flectest on their way, close-knit to glory, strong with varied power.

Sanskit Text: उग्रं व ओज सथिरा शवांस्यधा मरुद्भिर्गणस्तुविष्मान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughraṃ va oja sthirā śavāṃsyadhā marudbhirghaṇastuviṣmān ||
Translation: 7 Yea, mighty is your power and firm your strength: so, potent, with the Maruts, be the band.

Sanskit Text: शुभ्रो वः शुष्मः करुध्मी मनांसि धुनिर्मुनिरिव शर्धस्य धर्ष्णोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śubhro vaḥ śuṣmaḥ krudhmī manāṃsi dhunirmuniriva śardhasya dhṛṣṇoḥ ||
Translation: 8 Bright is your spirit, wrathful are your minds: your bold troop's minstrel is like one inspired.

Sanskit Text: सनेम्यस्मद युयोत दिद्युं मा वो दुर्मतिरिह परणं नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanemyasmad yuyota didyuṃ mā vo durmatiriha praṇaṃ naḥ ||
Translation: 9 Ever avert your blazing shaft from us, and let not your displeasure reach us here

Sanskit Text: परिया वो नाम हुवे तुराणामा यत तर्पन मरुतो वावशानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyā vo nāma huve turāṇāmā yat tṛpan maruto vāvaśānāḥ ||
Translation: 10 Your dear names, conquering Maruts, we invoke, calling aloud till we are satisfied.

Sanskit Text: सवायुधास इष्मिणः सुनिष्का उत सवयं तन्वः शुम्भमानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāyudhāsa iṣmiṇaḥ suniṣkā uta svayaṃ tanvaḥ śumbhamānāḥ ||
Translation: 11 Well-armed, impetuous in their haste, they deck themselves, their forms, with oblations: to you, the pure, ornaments made of gold.

Sanskit Text: शुची वो हव्या मरुतः शुचीनां शुचिं हिनोम्यध्वरं शुचिभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śucī vo havyā marutaḥ śucīnāṃ śuciṃ hinomyadhvaraṃ śucibhyaḥ |
Translation: 12 Pure, Maruts, pure yourselves, are your oblations: to you, the pure, pure sacrifice I offer.

Sanskit Text: रतेन सत्यं रतसाप आयञ्छुचिजन्मानः शुचयः पावकाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtena satyaṃ ṛtasāpa āyañchucijanmānaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ ||
Translation: By Law they came to truth, the Law's observers, bright by their birth, and pure, and sanctifying.

Sanskit Text: अंसेष्वा मरुतः खादयो वो वक्षस्सु रुक्मा उपशिश्रियाणाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṃseṣvā marutaḥ khādayo vo vakṣassu rukmā upaśiśriyāṇāḥ |
Translation: 13 Your rings, O Maruts, rest upon your shoulders, and chains of gold are twined upon your bosoms.

Sanskit Text: वि विद्युतो न वर्ष्टिभी रुचाना अनु सवधामायुधैर्यछमानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi vidyuto na vṛṣṭibhī rucānā anu svadhāmāyudhairyachamānāḥ ||
Translation: Gleaming with drops of rain, like lightning-flashes, after your wont ye whirl about your weapons.

Sanskit Text: पर बुध्न्या व ईरते महांसि पर नामानि परयज्यवस्तिरध्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra budhnyā va īrate mahāṃsi pra nāmāni prayajyavastiradhvam |
Translation: 14 Wide in the depth of air spread forth your glories, far, most adorable, ye bear your titles.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रियं दम्यं भागमेतं गर्हमेधीयं मरुतो जुषध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasriyaṃ damyaṃ bhāghametaṃ ghṛhamedhīyaṃ maruto juṣadhvam ||
Translation: Maruts, accept this thousandfold allotment of household sacrifice and household treasure.

Sanskit Text: यदि सतुतस्य मरुतो अधीथेत्था विप्रस्य वाजिनो हवीमन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadi stutasya maruto adhīthetthā viprasya vājino havīman |
Translation: 15 If, Maruts, ye regard the praise recited here at this mighty singer invocation,

Sanskit Text: मक्षू रायः सुवीर्यस्य दात नू चिद यमन्य आदभदरावा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: makṣū rāyaḥ suvīryasya dāta nū cid yamanya ādabhadarāvā ||
Translation: Vouchsafe us quickly wealth with noble heroes, wealth which no man uho hateth us may injure.

Sanskit Text: अत्यासो न ये मरुतः सवञ्चो यक्षद्र्शो न शुभयन्त मर्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atyāso na ye marutaḥ svañco yakṣadṛśo na śubhayanta maryāḥ |
Translation: 16 The Maruts, fleet as coursers, while they deck them like youths spectators of a festal meeting,

Sanskit Text: ते हर्म्येष्ठाः शिशवो न शुभ्रा वत्सासो न परक्रीळिनः पयोधाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te harmyeṣṭhāḥ śiśavo na śubhrā vatsāso na prakrīḷinaḥ payodhāḥ ||
Translation: Linger, like beauteous colts, about the dwelling, like frisking calves, these who pour down the water.

Sanskit Text: दशस्यन्तो नो मरुतो मर्ळन्तु वरिवस्यन्तो रोदसी सुमेके |
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśasyanto no maruto mṛḷantu varivasyanto rodasī sumeke |
Translation: 17 So may the Maruts help us and be gracious, bringing free room to lovely Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: आरे गोहा नर्हा वधो वो अस्तु सुम्नेभिरस्मे वसवो नमध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āre ghohā nṛhā vadho vo astu sumnebhirasme vasavo namadhvam ||
Translation: Far be your bolt that slayeth men and cattle. Ye Vasus, turn yourselves to us with blessings.

Sanskit Text: आ वो होता जोहवीति सत्तः सत्राचीं रातिं मरुतो गर्णानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vo hotā johavīti sattaḥ satrācīṃ rātiṃ maruto ghṛṇānaḥ |
Translation: 18 The priest, when seated, loudly calls you, Maruts, praising in song your universal bounty.

Sanskit Text: य ईवतो वर्षणो अस्ति गोपाः सो अद्वयावी हवते व उक्थैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya īvato vṛṣaṇo asti ghopāḥ so advayāvī havate va ukthaiḥ ||
Translation: He, Bulls! who hath so much in his possession, free from duplicity, with hymns invokes you.

Sanskit Text: इमे तुरं मरुतो रामयन्तीमे सहः सहस आ नमन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime turaṃ maruto rāmayantīme sahaḥ sahasa ā namanti |
Translation: 19 These Maruts bring the swift man to a stand-still, and strength with mightier strength they break and humble

Sanskit Text: इमेशंसं वनुष्यतो नि पान्ति गुरु दवेषो अररुषे दधन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imeśaṃsaṃ vanuṣyato ni pānti ghuru dveṣo araruṣe dadhanti ||
Translation: These guard the singer from the man who hates him and lay their sore displeasure on the wicked.

Sanskit Text: इमे रध्रं चिन मरुतो जुनन्ति भर्मिं चिद यथा वसवो जुषन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime radhraṃ cin maruto junanti bhṛmiṃ cid yathā vasavo juṣanta |
Translation: 20 These Maruts rouse even the poor and needy: the Vasus love him as an active champion.

Sanskit Text: अप बाधध्वं वर्षणस्तमांसि धत्त विश्वं तनय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa bādhadhvaṃ vṛṣaṇastamāṃsi dhatta viśvaṃ tanaya ||
Translation: Drive to a distance, O ye Bulls, the darkness: give us full store of children and descendants.

Sanskit Text: ं तोकमस्मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṃ tokamasme ||
Translation: 21 Never, O Maruts, may we lose your bounty, nor, car-borne Lords! be hitidmost when ye deal it.

Sanskit Text: मा वो दात्रान मरुतो निरराम मा पश्चाद दघ्म रथ्यो विभागे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā vo dātrān maruto nirarāma mā paścād daghma rathyo vibhāghe |
Translation: Give us a share in that delightful treasure, the genuine wealth that, Bulls! is your possession.

Sanskit Text: आ न सपार्हे भजतना वसव्ये यदीं सुजातं वर्षणो वो अस्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā na spārhe bhajatanā vasavye yadīṃ sujātaṃ vṛṣaṇo vo asti ||
Translation: 22 What time the men in fury rush together for running streams, for pastures, and for houses.

Sanskit Text: सं यद धनन्त मन्युभिर्जनासः शूरा यह्वीष्वोषधीषु विक्षु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yad dhananta manyubhirjanāsaḥ śūrā yahvīṣvoṣadhīṣu vikṣu |
Translation: Then, O ye Maruts, ye who spring from Rudra, be our protectors in the strife with foemen.

Sanskit Text: अध समा नो मरुतो रुद्रियासस्त्रातारो भूत पर्तनास्वर्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha smā no maruto rudriyāsastrātāro bhūta pṛtanāsvaryaḥ ||
Translation: 23 Full many a deed ye did for our forefathers worthy of lauds which, even of old, they sang you.

Sanskit Text: भूरि चक्र मरुतः पित्र्याण्युक्थानि या वः शस्यन्ते पुरा चित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūri cakra marutaḥ pitryāṇyukthāni yā vaḥ śasyante purā cit |
Translation: lle strong man, with the Maruts, wins in battle, the charger, with the Maruts, gains the booty.

Sanskit Text: मरुद्भिरुग्रः पर्तनासु साळ्हा मरुद्भिरित सनिता वाजमर्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: marudbhirughraḥ pṛtanāsu sāḷhā marudbhirit sanitā vājamarvā ||
Translation: 24 Ours, O ye Maruts, be the vigorous Hero, the Lord Divine of men, the strong Sustainer,

Sanskit Text: अस्मे वीरो मरुतः शुष्म्यस्तु जनानां यो असुरो विधर्ता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme vīro marutaḥ śuṣmyastu janānāṃ yo asuro vidhartā |
Translation: With whom to fair lands we may cross the waters, and dwell in our own home with you beside us.

Sanskit Text: अपो येन सुक्षितये तरेमाध सवमोको अभि वः सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apo yena sukṣitaye taremādha svamoko abhi vaḥ syāma ||
Translation: 25 May Indra, Mitra, Varuṇa and Agni, Waters, and Plants, and Trees accept our praises.

Sanskit Text: तन न इन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan na indro varuṇo mitro aghnir... ||
Translation: May we find shelter in the Marut's bosom. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: मध्वो वो नाम मारुतं यजत्राः पर यज्ञेषु शवसा मदन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhvo vo nāma mārutaṃ yajatrāḥ pra yajñeṣu śavasā madanti |
Translation: 1. YEA, through the power of your sweet juice, ye Holy! the Marut host is glad at sacrifices.

Sanskit Text: ये रेजयन्ति रोदसी चिदुर्वी पिन्वन्त्युत्सं यदयासुरुग्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye rejayanti rodasī cidurvī pinvantyutsaṃ yadayāsurughrāḥ ||
Translation: They cause even spacious heaven and earth to tremble, they make the spring flow when they come, the Mighty.

Sanskit Text: निचेतारो हि मरुतो गर्णन्तं परणेतारो यजमानस्य मन्म |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nicetāro hi maruto ghṛṇantaṃ praṇetāro yajamānasya manma |
Translation: 2 The Maruts watch the man who sings their praises, promoters of the thought of him who worships.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकमद्य विदथेषु बर्हिरा वीतये सदत पिप्रियाणाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākamadya vidatheṣu barhirā vītaye sadata pipriyāṇāḥ ||
Translation: Seat you on sacred grass in our assembly, this day, with friendly minds, to share the banquet.

Sanskit Text: नैतावदन्ये मरुतो यथेमे भराजन्ते रुक्मैरायुधैस्तनूभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: naitāvadanye maruto yatheme bhrājante rukmairāyudhaistanūbhiḥ |
Translation: 3 No others gleam so brightly as these Maruts with their own forms, their golden gauds, their weapons.

Sanskit Text: आ रोदसी विश्वपिशः पिशानाः समानमञ्ज्यञ्जते शुभे कम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā rodasī viśvapiśaḥ piśānāḥ samānamañjyañjate śubhe kam ||
Translation: With all adornments, decking earth and heaven, they heighten, for bright show, their common splendour.

Sanskit Text: रधक सा वो मरुतो दिद्युदस्तु यद व आगः पुरुषता कराम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛdhak sā vo maruto didyudastu yad va āghaḥ puruṣatā karāma |
Translation: 4 Far from us be your blazing dart, O Maruts, when we, through human frailty, sin against you.

Sanskit Text: मा वस्तस्यामपि भूमा यजत्रा अस्मे वो अस्तु सुमतिश्चनिष्ठा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā vastasyāmapi bhūmā yajatrā asme vo astu sumatiścaniṣṭhā ||
Translation: Let us not he exposed to that, ye Holy! May your most loving favour still attend us.

Sanskit Text: कर्ते चिदत्र मरुतो रणन्तानवद्यासः शुचयः पावकाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛte cidatra maruto raṇantānavadyāsaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ |
Translation: 5 May even what we have done delight the Maruts, the blameless Ones, the bright, the purifying.

Sanskit Text: पर णो.अवत सुमतिभिर्यजत्राः पर वाजेभिस्तिरत पुष्यसे नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ṇo.avata sumatibhiryajatrāḥ pra vājebhistirata puṣyase naḥ ||
Translation: Further us, O ye Holy, with your kindness: advance us mightily that we may prosper.

Sanskit Text: उत सतुतासो मरुतो वयन्तु विश्वेभिर्नामभिर्नरो हवींषि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta stutāso maruto vyantu viśvebhirnāmabhirnaro havīṃṣi |
Translation: 6 And may the Maruts, praised by all their titles, Heroes, enjoy the taste of our oblations.

Sanskit Text: ददात नो अम्र्तस्य परजायै जिग्र्त रायः सून्र्ता मघानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadāta no amṛtasya prajāyai jighṛta rāyaḥ sūnṛtā maghāni ||
Translation: Give us of Amṛta for the sake of offspring: awake the excellent fair stores of riches.

Sanskit Text: आ सतुतासो मरुतो विश्व ऊती अछा सूरीन सर्वताता जिगात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā stutāso maruto viśva ūtī achā sūrīn sarvatātā jighāta |
Translation: 7 Hither, ye Maruts, praised, with all your succours, with all felicity come to our princes,

Sanskit Text: ये नस्त्मना शतिनो वर्धयन्ति यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye nastmanā śatino vardhayanti yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Who, of themselves, a hundredfold increase us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: पर साकमुक्षे अर्चता गणाय यो दैव्यस्य धाम्नस्तुविष्मान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sākamukṣe arcatā ghaṇāya yo daivyasya dhāmnastuviṣmān |
Translation: 1. SING to the troop that pours down rain in common, the Mighty Company of celestial nature.

Sanskit Text: उत कषोदन्ति रोदसी महित्वा नक्षन्ते नाकं निरतेरवंशात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta kṣodanti rodasī mahitvā nakṣante nākaṃ nirteravaṃśāt ||
Translation: They make the world-halves tremble with their greatness: from depths of earth and sky they reach to heaven.

Sanskit Text: जनूश्चिद वो मरुतस्त्वेष्येण भीमासस्तुविमन्यवो.अयासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: janūścid vo marutastveṣyeṇa bhīmāsastuvimanyavo.ayāsaḥ |
Translation: 2 Yea, your birth, Maruts, was with wild commotion, ye who move swiftly, fierce in wrath, terrific.

Sanskit Text: पर ये महोभिरोजसोत सन्ति विश्वो वो यामन भयते सवर्द्र्क ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ye mahobhirojasota santi viśvo vo yāman bhayate svardṛk ||
Translation: Ye all-surpassing in your might and vigour, each looker on the light fears at your coming.

Sanskit Text: बर्हद वयो मघवद्भ्यो दधात जुजोषन्निन मरुतः सुष्टुतिं नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhad vayo maghavadbhyo dadhāta jujoṣannin marutaḥ suṣṭutiṃ naḥ |
Translation: 3 Give ample vital power unto our princes let our fair praises gratify the Maruts.

Sanskit Text: गतो नाध्वा वि तिराति जन्तुं पर ण सपार्हाभिरूतिभिस्तिरेत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghato nādhvā vi tirāti jantuṃ pra ṇa spārhābhirūtibhistireta ||
Translation: As the way travelled helpeth people onward, so further us with your delightful succours.

Sanskit Text: युष्मोतो विप्रो मरुतः शतस्वी युष्मोतो अर्वा सहुरिः सहस्री |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmoto vipro marutaḥ śatasvī yuṣmoto arvā sahuriḥ sahasrī |
Translation: 4 Your favoured singer counts his wealth by hundreds: the strong steed whom ye favour wins a thousand.

Sanskit Text: युष्मोतः सम्राळ उत हन्ति वर्त्रं पर तद वो अस्तु धूतयो देष्णम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmotaḥ samrāḷ uta hanti vṛtraṃ pra tad vo astu dhūtayo deṣṇam ||
Translation: The Sovran whom ye aid destroys the foeman. May this your gift, ye Shakers, be distinguished.

Sanskit Text: ताना रुद्रस्य मीळ्हुषो विवासे कुविन नंसन्ते मरुतः पुनर्नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tānā rudrasya mīḷhuṣo vivāse kuvin naṃsante marutaḥ punarnaḥ |
Translation: 5 I call, as such, the Sons of bounteous Rudra: will not the Maruts turn again to us-ward?

Sanskit Text: यत सस्वर्ता जिहीळिरे यदाविरव तदेन ईमहे तुराणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat sasvartā jihīḷire yadāvirava tadena īmahe turāṇām ||
Translation: What secret sin or open stirs their anger, that we implore the Swift Ones to forgive us.

Sanskit Text: परा सा वाचि सुष्टुतिर्मघोनामिदं सूक्तं मरुतो जुषन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prā sā vāci suṣṭutirmaghonāmidaṃ sūktaṃ maruto juṣanta |
Translation: 6 This eulogy of the Bounteous hath been spoken: accept, ye Maruts, this our hymn of praises.

Sanskit Text: आराच्चिद दवेषो वर्षणो युयोत यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ārāccid dveṣo vṛṣaṇo yuyota yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Ye Bulls, keep those who hate us at a distance. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: यं तरायध्व इदम-इदं देवासो यं च नयथ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ trāyadhva idam-idaṃ devāso yaṃ ca nayatha |
Translation: 1. WHOMSO ye rescue here and there, whomso ye guide, O Deities,

Sanskit Text: तस्मा अग्ने वरुण मित्रार्यमन मरुतः शर्म यछत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmā aghne varuṇa mitrāryaman marutaḥ śarma yachata ||
Translation: To him give shelter, Agni, Mitra, Varuṇa, ye Maruts, and thou Aryaman.

Sanskit Text: युष्माकं देवा अवसाहनि परिय ईजानस्तरति दविषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmākaṃ devā avasāhani priya ījānastarati dviṣaḥ |
Translation: 2 Through your kind favour, Gods, on some auspicious day, the worshipper subdues his foes.

Sanskit Text: पर स कषयं तिरते वि महीरिषो यो वो वराय दाशति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sa kṣayaṃ tirate vi mahīriṣo yo vo varāya dāśati ||
Translation: That man increases home and strengthening ample food who brings you offerings as ye list.

Sanskit Text: नहि वश्चरमं चन वसिष्ठः परिमंसते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi vaścaramaṃ cana vasiṣṭhaḥ parimaṃsate |
Translation: 3 Vasiṣṭha will not overlook the lowliest one among you all.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकमद्य मरुतः सुते सचा विश्वे पिबत कामिनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākamadya marutaḥ sute sacā viśve pibata kāminaḥ ||
Translation: O Maruts, of our Soma juice effused to-day drink all of you with eager haste.

Sanskit Text: नहि व ऊतिः पर्तनासु मर्धति यस्मा अराध्वं नरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi va ūtiḥ pṛtanāsu mardhati yasmā arādhvaṃ naraḥ |
Translation: 4 Your succour in the battle injures not the man to whom ye, Heroes, grant your gifts.

Sanskit Text: अभि व आवर्त सुमतिर्नवीयसी तूयं यात पिपीषवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi va āvart sumatirnavīyasī tūyaṃ yāta pipīṣavaḥ ||
Translation: May your most recent favour turn to us again. Come quickly, ye who fain would drink.

Sanskit Text: ओ षु घर्ष्विराधसो यातनान्धांसि पीतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: o ṣu ghṛṣvirādhaso yātanāndhāṃsi pītaye |
Translation: 5 Come hitherward to drink the juice, O ye whose bounties give you joy.

Sanskit Text: इमा वो हव्या मरुतो ररे हि कं मो षवन्यत्र गन्तन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā vo havyā maruto rare hi kaṃ mo ṣvanyatra ghantana ||
Translation: These offerings are for you, these, Maruts, I present. Go not to any place but this.

Sanskit Text: आ च नो बर्हिः सदताविता च न सपार्हाणि दातवे वसु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ca no barhiḥ sadatāvitā ca na spārhāṇi dātave vasu |
Translation: 6 Sit on our sacred grass, be graciously inclined to give the wealth for which we long,

Sanskit Text: अस्रेधन्तो मरुतः सोम्ये मधौ सवाहेह मादयाध्वै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asredhanto marutaḥ somye madhau svāheha mādayādhvai ||
Translation: To take delight, ye Maruts, Friends of all, with Svāhā, in sweet Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: सस्वश्चिद धि तन्वः शुम्भमाना आ हंसासो नीलप्र्ष्ठा अपप्तन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sasvaścid dhi tanvaḥ śumbhamānā ā haṃsāso nīlapṛṣṭhā apaptan |
Translation: 7 Decking the beauty of their forms in secret the Swans with purple backs have flown down hither.

Sanskit Text: विश्वं शर्धो अभितो मा नि षेद नरो न रण्वाः सवने मदन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvaṃ śardho abhito mā ni ṣeda naro na raṇvāḥ savane madantaḥ ||
Translation: Around me all the Company hath settled, like joyous Heroes glad in our libation.

Sanskit Text: यो नो मरुतो अभि दुर्ह्र्णायुस्तिरश्चित्तानि वसवो जिघांसति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo no maruto abhi durhṛṇāyustiraścittāni vasavo jighāṃsati |
Translation: 8 Maruts, the man whose wrath is hard to master, he who would slay us ere we think, O Vasus,

Sanskit Text: दरुहः पाशान परति स मुचीष्ट तपिष्ठेन हन्मनाहन्तना तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: druhaḥ pāśān prati sa mucīṣṭa tapiṣṭhena hanmanāhantanā tam ||
Translation: May he be tangled in the toils of mischief; smite ye him down with your most flaming weapon.

Sanskit Text: सान्तपना इदं हविर्मरुतस्तज्जुजुष्टन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sāntapanā idaṃ havirmarutastajjujuṣṭana |
Translation: 9 O Maruts, ye consuming Gods, enjoy this offering brought for you,

Sanskit Text: युष्माकोतीरिशादसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmākotīriśādasaḥ ||
Translation: To help us, ye who slay the foe.

Sanskit Text: गर्हमेधास आ गत मरुतो माप भूतन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛhamedhāsa ā ghata maruto māpa bhūtana |
Translation: 10 Sharers of household sacrifice, come, Maruts, stay not far away,

Sanskit Text: युष्माकोती सुदानवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmākotī sudānavaḥ ||
Translation: That ye may help us, Bounteous Ones.

Sanskit Text: इहेह वः सवतवसः कवयः सूर्यत्वचः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iheha vaḥ svatavasaḥ kavayaḥ sūryatvacaḥ |
Translation: 11 Here, Self-strong Maruts, yea, even here. ye Sages with your sunbright skins

Sanskit Text: यज्ञं मरुत आव्र्णे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñaṃ maruta āvṛṇe ||
Translation: I dedicate your sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: तर्यम्बकं यजामहे सुगन्धिं पुष्टिवर्धनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tryambakaṃ yajāmahe sughandhiṃ puṣṭivardhanam |
Translation: 12 Tryambaka we worship, sweet augmenter of prosperity.

Sanskit Text: उर्वारुकमिवबन्धनान मर्त्योर्मुक्षीय माम्र्तात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: urvārukamivabandhanān mṛtyormukṣīya māmṛtāt ||
Translation: As from its stem the cucumber, so may I be released from death, not reft of immortality.

Sanskit Text: यदद्य सूर्य बरवो.अनागा उद्यन मित्राय वरुणाय सत्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadadya sūrya bravo.anāghā udyan mitrāya varuṇāya satyam |
Translation: 1. WHEN thou, O Sun, this day, arising sinless, shalt speak the truth to Varuṇa and Mitra,

Sanskit Text: वयं देवत्रादिते सयाम तव परियासो अर्यमन गर्णन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ devatrādite syāma tava priyāso aryaman ghṛṇantaḥ ||
Translation: O Aditi, may all the Deities love us, and thou, O Aryaman, while we are singing.

Sanskit Text: एष सय मित्रावरुणा नर्चक्षा उभे उदेति सूर्यो अभि जमन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa sya mitrāvaruṇā nṛcakṣā ubhe udeti sūryo abhi jman |
Translation: 2 Looking on man, O Varuṇa and Mitra, this Sun ascendeth up by both the pathways,

Sanskit Text: विश्वस्य सथातुर्जगतश्च गोपा रजु मर्तेषु वर्जिना चपश्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvasya sthāturjaghataśca ghopā ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā capaśyan ||
Translation: Guardian of all things fixt, of all that moveth, beholding good and evil acts of mortals.

Sanskit Text: अयुक्त सप्त हरितः सधस्थाद या ईं वहन्ति सूर्यं घर्ताचीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayukta sapta haritaḥ sadhasthād yā īṃ vahanti sūryaṃ ghṛtācīḥ |
Translation: 3 He from their home hath yoked the Seven gold Coursers who, dropping oil and fatness, carry Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: धामानि मित्रावरुणा युवाकुः सं यो यूथेव जनिमानि चष्टे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhāmāni mitrāvaruṇā yuvākuḥ saṃ yo yūtheva janimāni caṣṭe ||
Translation: Yours, Varuṇa and Mitra, he surveyeth the worlds and living creatures like a herdsman.

Sanskit Text: उद वां पर्क्षासो मधुमन्तो अस्थुरा सूर्यो अरुहच्छुक्रमर्णः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud vāṃ pṛkṣāso madhumanto asthurā sūryo aruhacchukramarṇaḥ |
Translation: 4 Your coursers rich in store of sweets have mounted: to the bright ocean Sūrya hath ascended,

Sanskit Text: यस्मा आदित्या अध्वनो रदन्ति मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणःसजोषाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasmā ādityā adhvano radanti mitro aryamā varuṇaḥsajoṣāḥ ||
Translation: For whom the Ādityas make his pathway ready, Aryaman, Mitra, Varuṇa, accordant.

Sanskit Text: इमे चेतारो अन्र्तस्य भूरेर्मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणो हि सन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime cetāro anṛtasya bhūrermitro aryamā varuṇo hi santi |
Translation: 5 For these, even Aryaman, Varuṇa and Mitra, are the chastisers of all guile and falsehood.

Sanskit Text: इम रतस्य वाव्र्धुर्दुरोणे शग्मासः पुत्रा अदितेरदब्धाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ima ṛtasya vāvṛdhurduroṇe śaghmāsaḥ putrā aditeradabdhāḥ ||
Translation: These, Aditi's Sons, infallible and mighty, have waxen in the home of law Eternal.

Sanskit Text: इमे मित्रो वरुणो दूळभासो.अचेतसं चिच्चितयन्ति दक्षैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime mitro varuṇo dūḷabhāso.acetasaṃ ciccitayanti dakṣaiḥ |
Translation: 6 These, Mitra, Varuṇa whom none deceiveth, with great power quicken even the fool to wisdom,

Sanskit Text: अपि करतुं सुचेतसं वतन्तस्तिरश्चिदंहः सुपथानयन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: api kratuṃ sucetasaṃ vatantastiraścidaṃhaḥ supathānayanti ||
Translation: And, wakening, moreover, thoughtful insight, lead it by easy paths o’er grief and trouble.

Sanskit Text: इमे दिवो अनिमिषा पर्थिव्याश्चिकित्वांसो अचेतसं नयन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime divo animiṣā pṛthivyāścikitvāṃso acetasaṃ nayanti |
Translation: 7 They ever vigilant, with eyes that close not, caring for heaven and earth, lead on the thoughtless.

Sanskit Text: परव्राजे चिन नद्यो गाधमस्ति पारं नो अस्य विष्पितस्य पर्षन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pravrāje cin nadyo ghādhamasti pāraṃ no asya viṣpitasya parṣan ||
Translation: Even in the river's bed there is a shallow. across this broad expanse may they conduct us.

Sanskit Text: यद गोपावददितिः शर्म भद्रं मित्रो यछन्ति वरुणः सुदासे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad ghopāvadaditiḥ śarma bhadraṃ mitro yachanti varuṇaḥ sudāse |
Translation: 8 When Aditi and Varuṇa and Mitra, like guardians, give Sudās their friendly shelter,

Sanskit Text: तस्मिन्ना तोकं तनयं दधाना मा कर्म देवहेळनं तुरासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasminnā tokaṃ tanayaṃ dadhānā mā karma devaheḷanaṃ turāsaḥ ||
Translation: Granting him sons and lineal succession, let us not, bold ones! move the Gods to anger.

Sanskit Text: अव वेदिं होत्राभिर्यजेत रिपः काश्चिद वरुणध्रुतः सः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava vediṃ hotrābhiryajeta ripaḥ kāścid varuṇadhrutaḥ saḥ |
Translation: 9 May he with ofierings purify the altar from any stains of Varuṇa's reviler.

Sanskit Text: परि दवेषोभिरर्यमा वर्णक्तूरुं सुदासे वर्षणा उ लोकम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari dveṣobhiraryamā vṛṇaktūruṃ sudāse vṛṣaṇā u lokam ||
Translation: Aryaman save us us all those who hate us: give room and freedom to Sudās, ye Mighty.

Sanskit Text: सस्वश्चिद धि सम्र्तिस्त्वेष्येषामपीच्येन सहसा सहन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sasvaścid dhi samṛtistveṣyeṣāmapīcyena sahasā sahante |
Translation: 10 Hid from our eyes is their resplendent meeting: by their mysterious might they hold dominion.

Sanskit Text: युष्मद भिया वर्षणो रेजमाना दक्षस्य चिन महिना मर्ळता नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmad bhiyā vṛṣaṇo rejamānā dakṣasya cin mahinā mṛḷatā naḥ ||
Translation: Heroes! we cry trembling in fear before you, even in the greatness of your power have mercy.

Sanskit Text: यो बरह्मणे सुमतिमायजाते वाजस्य सातौ परमस्य रायः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo brahmaṇe sumatimāyajāte vājasya sātau paramasya rāyaḥ |
Translation: 11 He who wins favour for his prayer by worship, that he may gain him strength and highest riches,

Sanskit Text: सीक्षन्त मन्युं मघवानो अर्य उरु कषयाय चक्रिरे सुधातु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sīkṣanta manyuṃ maghavāno arya uru kṣayāya cakrire sudhātu ||
Translation: That good man's mind the Mighty Ones will follow: they have brought comfort to his spacious dwelling.

Sanskit Text: इयं देव पुरोहितिर्युवभ्यां यज्ञेषु मित्रावरुणावकारि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyaṃ deva purohitiryuvabhyāṃ yajñeṣu mitrāvaruṇāvakāri |
Translation: 12 This priestly task, Gods! Varuṇa and Mitra! hath been performed for you at sacrifices.

Sanskit Text: विश्वानि दुर्गा पिप्र्तं तिरो नो यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāni durghā pipṛtaṃ tiro no yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Convey us safely over every peril. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: उत सूर्यो बर्हदर्चींष्यश्रेत पुरु विश्वा जनिम मानुषाणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut sūryo bṛhadarcīṃṣyaśret puru viśvā janima mānuṣāṇām |
Translation: 1. SURYA hath sent aloft his beams of splendour o’er all the tribes of men in countless places.

Sanskit Text: समो दिवा दद्र्शे रोचमानः करत्वा कर्तः सुक्र्तःकर्त्र्भिर्भूत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samo divā dadṛśe rocamānaḥ kratvā kṛtaḥ sukṛtaḥkartṛbhirbhūt ||
Translation: Together with the heaven he shines apparent, formed by his Makers well with power and wisdom.

Sanskit Text: स सूर्य परति पुरो न उद गा एभिः सतोमेभिरेतशेभिरेवैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sūrya prati puro na ud ghā ebhiḥ stomebhiretaśebhirevaiḥ |
Translation: 2 So hast thou mounted up before us, Sūrya, through these our praises, with fleet dappled horses.

Sanskit Text: पर नो मित्राय वरुणाय वोचो.अनागसो अर्यम्णे अग्नये च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra no mitrāya varuṇāya voco.anāghaso aryamṇe aghnaye ca ||
Translation: Declare us free from all offence to Mitra, and Varuṇa, and Aryaman, and Agni.

Sanskit Text: वि नः सहस्रं शुरुधो रदन्त्व रतावानो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi naḥ sahasraṃ śurudho radantv ṛtāvāno varuṇo mitro aghniḥ |
Translation: 3 May holy Agni, Varuṇa, and Mitra send down their riches upon us in thousands.

Sanskit Text: यछन्तु चन्द्रा उपमं नो अर्कमा नः कामं पूपुरन्तुस्तवानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yachantu candrā upamaṃ no arkamā naḥ kāmaṃ pūpurantustavānāḥ ||
Translation: May they, the Bright Ones, make our praise-song perfect, and, when we laud them, grant us all our wishes.

Sanskit Text: दयावाभूमी अदिते तरासीथां नो ये वां जज्ञुः सुजनिमान रष्वे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyāvābhūmī adite trāsīthāṃ no ye vāṃ jajñuḥ sujanimāna ṛṣve |
Translation: 4 O undivided Heaven and Earth, preserve us, us, Lofty Ones! your nobIy-born descendants.

Sanskit Text: मा हेळे भूम वरुणस्य वायोर्मा मित्रस्य परियतमस्य नर्णाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā heḷe bhūma varuṇasya vāyormā mitrasya priyatamasya nṛṇām ||
Translation: Let us not anger Varuṇa, nor Vāyu, nor him, the dearest Friend of mortals, Mitra.

Sanskit Text: पर बाहवा सिस्र्तं जीवसे न आ नो गव्यूतिमुक्षतं घर्तेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra bāhavā sisṛtaṃ jīvase na ā no ghavyūtimukṣataṃ ghṛtena |
Translation: 5 Stretch forth your arms and let our lives be lengthened: with fatness dew the pastures of our cattle.

Sanskit Text: आ नो जने शरवयतं युवाना शरुतं मे मित्रावरुणा हवेमा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no jane śravayataṃ yuvānā śrutaṃ me mitrāvaruṇā havemā ||
Translation: Ye Youthful, make us famed among the people: hear, Mitra-Varuṇa, these mine invocations.

Sanskit Text: नू मित्रो वरुणो अर्यमा नस्त्मने तोकाय वरिवो दधन्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū mitro varuṇo aryamā nastmane tokāya varivo dadhantu |
Translation: 6 Now Mitra, Varuṇa, Aryaman vouchsafe us freedom and room, for us and for our children.

Sanskit Text: सुगा नो विश्वा सुपथानि सन्तु यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sughā no viśvā supathāni santu yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: May we find paths all fair and good to travel. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: दिवि कषयन्ता रजसः पर्थिव्यां पर वां घर्तस्य निर्णिजोददीरन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divi kṣayantā rajasaḥ pṛthivyāṃ pra vāṃ ghṛtasya nirṇijodadīran |
Translation: 1. YE Twain who rule, in heaven and earth, the region, clothed be your clouds in robes of oil and fatness.

Sanskit Text: हव्यं नो मित्रो अर्यमा सुजातो राजा सुक्षत्रो वरुणो जुषन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: havyaṃ no mitro aryamā sujāto rājā sukṣatro varuṇo juṣanta ||
Translation: May the imperial Varuṇa, and Mitra, and high-born Aryaman accept our presents.

Sanskit Text: आ राजाना मह रतस्य गोपा सिन्धुपती कषत्रिया यातमर्वाक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā rājānā maha ṛtasya ghopā sindhupatī kṣatriyā yātamarvāk |
Translation: 2 Kings, guards of rrtighty everlasting Order, come hitherward, ye Princes, Lords of Rivers.

Sanskit Text: इळां नो मित्रावरुणोत वर्ष्टिमव दिव इन्वतं जीरदानू ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iḷāṃ no mitrāvaruṇota vṛṣṭimava diva invataṃ jīradānū ||
Translation: Send us from heaven, O Varuṇa and Mitra, rain and sweet food, ye who pour down your bounties.

Sanskit Text: मित्रस्तन नो वरुणो देवो अर्यः पर साधिष्ठेभिः पथिभिर्नयन्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitrastan no varuṇo devo aryaḥ pra sādhiṣṭhebhiḥ pathibhirnayantu |
Translation: 3 May the dear God, and Varuṇa and Mitra conduct us by the most effective pathways,

Sanskit Text: बरवद यथा न आदरिः सुदास इषा मदेम सह देवगोपाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bravad yathā na ādariḥ sudāsa iṣā madema saha devaghopāḥ ||
Translation: That foes may say unto Sudās our chieftain, May, we, too, joy in food with Gods to guard us.

Sanskit Text: यो वां गर्तं मनसा तक्षदेतमूर्ध्वां धीतिं कर्णवद धारयच्च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vāṃ ghartaṃ manasā takṣadetamūrdhvāṃ dhītiṃ kṛṇavad dhārayacca |
Translation: 4 Him who hath wrought for you this car in spirit, who makes the song rise upward and sustains it,

Sanskit Text: उक्षेथां मित्रावरुणा घर्तेन ता राजानासुक्षितीस्तर्पयेथाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukṣethāṃ mitrāvaruṇā ghṛtena tā rājānāsukṣitīstarpayethām ||
Translation: Bedew with fatness, Varuṇa nd Mitra ye Kings, make glad the pleasant dwelling-places.

Sanskit Text: एष सतोमो वरुण मित्र तुभ्यं सोमः शुक्रो न वायवे.अयामि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa stomo varuṇa mitra tubhyaṃ somaḥ śukro na vāyave.ayāmi |
Translation: 5 To you this laud, O Varuṇa and Mitra is offered like bright Soma juice to Vāyu.

Sanskit Text: अविष्टं धियो जिग्र्तं पुरम्धीर्यूयं पात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aviṣṭaṃ dhiyo jighṛtaṃ puramdhīryūyaṃ pāta ||
Translation: Favour our songs of praise, wake thought and spirit. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: पर मित्रयोर्वरुणयोः सतोमो न एतु शूष्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra mitrayorvaruṇayoḥ stomo na etu śūṣyaḥ |
Translation: 1. LET our strong hymn of praise go forth, the laud of Mitra-Varuṇa,

Sanskit Text: नमस्वान तुविजातयोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: namasvān tuvijātayoḥ ||
Translation: With homage to that high-born Pair;

Sanskit Text: या धारयन्त देवाः सुदक्षा दक्षपितरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā dhārayanta devāḥ sudakṣā dakṣapitarā |
Translation: 2 The Two exceeding wise, the Sons of Dakṣa, whom the gods ordained

Sanskit Text: असुर्याय परमहसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asuryāya pramahasā ||
Translation: For lordship, excellently great.

Sanskit Text: ता न सतिपा तनूपा वरुण जरितॄणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā na stipā tanūpā varuṇa jaritṝṇām |
Translation: 3 Such, Guardians of our homes and us, O Mitra-Varuṇa, fulfil

Sanskit Text: मित्र साधयतं धियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitra sādhayataṃ dhiyaḥ ||
Translation: The thoughts of those who sing your praise.

Sanskit Text: यदद्य सूर उदिते.अनागा मित्रो अर्यमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadadya sūra udite.anāghā mitro aryamā |
Translation: 4 So when the Sun hath risen to-day, may sinless Mitra, Aryaman,

Sanskit Text: सुवाति सविताभगः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvāti savitābhaghaḥ ||
Translation: Bhaga, and Savitar sendus forth.

Sanskit Text: सुप्रावीरस्तु स कषयः पर नु यामन सुदानवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suprāvīrastu sa kṣayaḥ pra nu yāman sudānavaḥ |
Translation: 5 May this our home be guarded well forward, ye Bounteous, on the way,

Sanskit Text: ये नो अंहो.अतिपिप्रति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye no aṃho.atipiprati ||
Translation: Who bear us safely o’er distress.

Sanskit Text: उत सवराजो अदितिरदब्धस्य वरतस्य ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta svarājo aditiradabdhasya vratasya ye |
Translation: 6. And those Self-reigning, Aditi, whose statute is inviolate,

Sanskit Text: महो राजान ईशते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maho rājāna īśate ||
Translation: The Kings who rule a vast domain.

Sanskit Text: परति वां सूर उदिते मित्रं गर्णीषे वरुणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati vāṃ sūra udite mitraṃ ghṛṇīṣe varuṇam |
Translation: 7 Soon as the Sun hath risen, to you, to Mitra-Varuṇa, I sing,

Sanskit Text: अर्यमणंरिशादसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aryamaṇaṃriśādasam ||
Translation: And Aryarnan who slays the foe.

Sanskit Text: राया हिरण्यया मतिरियमव्र्काय शवसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyā hiraṇyayā matiriyamavṛkāya śavase |
Translation: 8 With wealth of gold may this my song bring unmolested power and might,

Sanskit Text: इयं विप्रामेधसातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyaṃ viprāmedhasātaye ||
Translation: And, Brahmans, gain the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: ते सयाम देव वरुण ते मित्र सूरिभिः सह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te syāma deva varuṇa te mitra sūribhiḥ saha |
Translation: 9 May we be thine, God Varuṇa, and with our princes, Mitra, thine.

Sanskit Text: इषं सवश्च धीमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣaṃ svaśca dhīmahi ||
Translation: Food and Heaven's light will we obtain.

Sanskit Text: बहवः सूरचक्षसो.अग्निजिह्वा रताव्र्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bahavaḥ sūracakṣaso.aghnijihvā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ |
Translation: 10 Many are they who strengthen Law, Sun-eyed, with Agni for their tongue,

Sanskit Text: तरीणि ये येमुर्विदथानि धीतिभिर्विश्वानि परिभूतिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trīṇi ye yemurvidathāni dhītibhirviśvāni paribhūtibhiḥ ||
Translation: They who direct the three great gatherings with their thoughts, yea, all things with surpassing might.

Sanskit Text: वि ये दधुः शरदं मासमादहर्यज्ञमक्तुं चाद रचम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi ye dadhuḥ śaradaṃ māsamādaharyajñamaktuṃ cād ṛcam |
Translation: 11 They who have stablished year and month and then the day, night, sacrifice and holy verse,

Sanskit Text: अनाप्यं वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा कषत्रं राजान आशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anāpyaṃ varuṇo mitro aryamā kṣatraṃ rājāna āśata ||
Translation: Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryarnan, the Kings, have won dominion which none else may gain.

Sanskit Text: तद वो अद्य मनामहे सूक्तैः सूर उदिते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad vo adya manāmahe sūktaiḥ sūra udite |
Translation: 12 So at the rising of the Sun we think of you with hymns to-day,

Sanskit Text: यदोहते वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा यूयं रतस्य रथ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadohate varuṇo mitro aryamā yūyaṃ ṛtasya rathyaḥ ||
Translation: Even as Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman deserve: ye are the charioteers of Law.

Sanskit Text: रतावान रतजाता रताव्र्धो घोरासो अन्र्तद्विषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtāvāna ṛtajātā ṛtāvṛdho ghorāso anṛtadviṣaḥ |
Translation: 13 True to Law, born in Law the strengtheners of Law, terrible, haters of the false,

Sanskit Text: तेषांवः सुम्ने सुछर्दिष्टमे नरः सयाम ये च सूरयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: teṣāṃvaḥ sumne suchardiṣṭame naraḥ syāma ye ca sūrayaḥ ||
Translation: In their felicity which gives the best defence may we men and our princes dwell.

Sanskit Text: उदु तयद दर्शतं वपुर्दिव एति परतिह्वरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udu tyad darśataṃ vapurdiva eti pratihvare |
Translation: 14 Uprises, on the slope of heaven, that marvel that attracts die sight

Sanskit Text: यदीमाशुर्वहति देव एतशो विश्वस्मै चक्षसे अरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadīmāśurvahati deva etaśo viśvasmai cakṣase aram ||
Translation: As swift celestial Etaśa bears it away, prepared for every eye to see.

Sanskit Text: शीर्ष्णः-शीर्ष्णो जगतस्तस्थुषस पतिं समया विश्वमा रजः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śīrṣṇaḥ-śīrṣṇo jaghatastasthuṣas patiṃ samayā viśvamā rajaḥ |
Translation: 15 Lord of each single head, of fixt and moving things, equally through the whole expanse,

Sanskit Text: सप्त सवसारः सुविताय सूर्यं वहन्ति हरितो रथे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sapta svasāraḥ suvitāya sūryaṃ vahanti harito rathe ||
Translation: The Seven sister Bays bear Sūrya on his car, to bring us wealth and happiness.

Sanskit Text: तच्चक्षुर्देवहितं शुक्रमुच्चरत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taccakṣurdevahitaṃ śukramuccarat |
Translation: 16 A hundred autumns may we see that bright Eye, God-ordained, arise

Sanskit Text: पश्येम शरदः शतं जीवेम शरदः शतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: paśyema śaradaḥ śataṃ jīvema śaradaḥ śatam ||
Translation: A hundred autumns may we live.

Sanskit Text: काव्येभिरदाभ्या यातं वरुण दयुमत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kāvyebhiradābhyā yātaṃ varuṇa dyumat |
Translation: 17 Infallible through your wisdom, come hither, resplendent Varuṇa,

Sanskit Text: मित्रश्च सोमपीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitraśca somapītaye ||
Translation: And Mitra, to the Soma draught.

Sanskit Text: दिवो धामभिर्वरुण मित्रश्चा यातमद्रुहा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo dhāmabhirvaruṇa mitraścā yātamadruhā |
Translation: 18 Come as the laws of Heaven ordain, Varuṇa, Mitra, void of guile:

Sanskit Text: पिबतं सोममातुजी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibataṃ somamātujī ||
Translation: Press near and drink the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: आ यातं मित्रावरुणा जुषाणावाहुतिं नरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yātaṃ mitrāvaruṇā juṣāṇāvāhutiṃ narā |
Translation: 19 Come, Mitra, Varuṇa, accept, Heroes, our sacrificial gift:

Sanskit Text: पातं सोमं रताव्र्धा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pātaṃ somaṃ ṛtāvṛdhā ||
Translation: Drink Soma, ye who strengthen Law.

Sanskit Text: परति वां रथं नर्पती जरध्यै हविष्मता मनसा यज्ञियेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati vāṃ rathaṃ nṛpatī jaradhyai haviṣmatā manasā yajñiyena |
Translation: 1. I WITH a holy heart that brings oblation will sing forth praise to meet your car, ye Princes,

Sanskit Text: यो वां दूतो न धिष्ण्यावजीगरछा सूनुर्न पितरा विवक्मि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vāṃ dūto na dhiṣṇyāvajīgharachā sūnurna pitarā vivakmi ||
Translation: Which, Much-desired! hath wakened as your envoy. I call you hither as a son his parents.

Sanskit Text: अशोच्यग्निः समिधानो अस्मे उपो अद्र्श्रन तमसश्चिदन्ताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśocyaghniḥ samidhāno asme upo adṛśran tamasaścidantāḥ |
Translation: 2 Brightly hath Agni shone by us enkindled: the limits even of darkness were apparent.

Sanskit Text: अचेति केतुरुषसः पुरस्ताच्छ्रिये दिवो दुहितुर्जायमानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aceti keturuṣasaḥ purastācchriye divo duhiturjāyamānaḥ ||
Translation: Eastward is seen the Banner of the Morning, the Banner born to give Heaven's Daughter glory.

Sanskit Text: अभि वां नूनमश्विना सुहोता सतोमैः सिषक्ति नासत्या विवक्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi vāṃ nūnamaśvinā suhotā stomaiḥ siṣakti nāsatyā vivakvān |
Translation: 3 With hymns the deft priest is about you, Aśvins, the eloquent priest attends you now, Nāsatyas.

Sanskit Text: पूर्वीभिर्यातं पथ्याभिरर्वाक सवर्विदा वसुमता रथेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvībhiryātaṃ pathyābhirarvāk svarvidā vasumatā rathena ||
Translation: Come by the paths that ye are wont to travel, on car that finds the light, laden with treasure.

Sanskit Text: अवोर्वां नूनमश्विना युवाकुर्हुवे यद वां सुते माध्वीवसूयुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avorvāṃ nūnamaśvinā yuvākurhuve yad vāṃ sute mādhvīvasūyuḥ |
Translation: 4 When, suppliant for your help, Lovers of Sweetness! I seeking wealth call you to our libation,

Sanskit Text: आ वां वहन्तु सथविरासो अश्वाः पिबाथो अस्मेसुषुता मधूनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ vahantu sthavirāso aśvāḥ pibātho asmesuṣutā madhūni ||
Translation: Hitherward let your vigorous horses bear you: drink ye with us the well-pressed Soma juices.

Sanskit Text: पराचीमु देवाश्विना धियं मे.अम्र्ध्रां सातये कर्तं वसूयुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prācīmu devāśvinā dhiyaṃ me.amṛdhrāṃ sātaye kṛtaṃ vasūyum |
Translation: 5 Bring forward, Aśvins, Gods, to its fulfilment my never-wearied prayer that asks for riches.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा अविष्टं वाज आ पुरन्धीस्ता नः शक्तं शचीपती शचीभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā aviṣṭaṃ vāja ā purandhīstā naḥ śaktaṃ śacīpatī śacībhiḥ ||
Translation: Vouchsafe us all high spirit in the combat, and with your powers, O Lords of Power, assist us.

Sanskit Text: अविष्टं धीष्वश्विना न आसु परजावद रेतो अह्रयं नो अस्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aviṣṭaṃ dhīṣvaśvinā na āsu prajāvad reto ahrayaṃ no astu |
Translation: 6 Favour us in these prayers of ours, O Aśvins. May we have genial vigour, ne’er to fail us.

Sanskit Text: आ वां तोके तनये तूतुजानाः सुरत्नासो देववीतिंगमेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ toke tanaye tūtujānāḥ suratnāso devavītiṃghamema ||
Translation: So may we, strong in children and descendants, go, wealthy, to the banquet that awaits you.

Sanskit Text: एष सय वां पूर्वगत्वेव सख्ये निधिर्हितो माध्वी रातो अस्मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa sya vāṃ pūrvaghatveva sakhye nidhirhito mādhvī rāto asme |
Translation: 7 Lovers of Sweetness, we have brought this treasure to you as ’twere an envoy sent for friendship.

Sanskit Text: अहेळता मनसा यातमर्वागश्नन्ता हव्यं मानुषीषु विक्षु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aheḷatā manasā yātamarvāghaśnantā havyaṃ mānuṣīṣu vikṣu ||
Translation: Come unto us with spirits free from anger, in homes of men enjoying our oblation.

Sanskit Text: एकस्मिन योगे भुरणा समाने परि वां सप्त सरवतो रथो गात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ekasmin yoghe bhuraṇā samāne pari vāṃ sapta sravato ratho ghāt |
Translation: 8 With one, the same, intention, ye swift movers, o’er the Seven Rivers hath your chariot travelled.

Sanskit Text: न वायन्ति सुभ्वो देवयुक्ता ये वां धूर्षु तरणयोवहन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na vāyanti subhvo devayuktā ye vāṃ dhūrṣu taraṇayovahanti ||
Translation: Yoked by the Gods, your strong steeds never weary while speeding forward at the pole they bear you.

Sanskit Text: असश्चता मघवद्भ्यो हि भूतं ये राया मघदेयं जुनन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asaścatā maghavadbhyo hi bhūtaṃ ye rāyā maghadeyaṃ junanti |
Translation: 9 Exhaustless be your bounty to our princes who with their wealth incite the gift of riches,

Sanskit Text: पर ये बन्धुं सून्र्ताभिस्तिरन्ते गव्या पर्ञ्चन्तो अश्व्या मघानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ye bandhuṃ sūnṛtābhistirante ghavyā pṛñcanto aśvyā maghāni ||
Translation: Who further friendship with their noble natures, combining wealth in kine with wealth in herses.

Sanskit Text: नू मे हवमा शर्णुतं युवाना यासिष्टं वर्तिरश्विनाविरावत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū me havamā śṛṇutaṃ yuvānā yāsiṣṭaṃ vartiraśvināvirāvat |
Translation: 10 Now hear, O Youthful Twain, mine invocation: come, Aśvins, to the home where food aboundeth.

Sanskit Text: धत्तं रत्नानि जरतं च सूरीन यूयं पात .. . ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhattaṃ ratnāni jarataṃ ca sūrīn yūyaṃ pāta .. . ||
Translation: Vouchsafe us wealth, do honour to our nobles. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: आ शुभ्रा यातमश्विना सवश्वा गिरो दस्रा जुजुषाणा युवाकोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā śubhrā yātamaśvinā svaśvā ghiro dasrā jujuṣāṇā yuvākoḥ |
Translation: 1. COME, radiant Aśvins, with your noble horses: accept your servant's hymns, ye Wonder-Workers:

Sanskit Text: हव्यानि च परतिभ्र्ता वीतं नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: havyāni ca pratibhṛtā vītaṃ naḥ ||
Translation: Enjoy oblations which we bring to greet you.

Sanskit Text: पर वामन्धांसि मद्यान्यस्थुररं गन्तं हविषो वीतये मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vāmandhāṃsi madyānyasthuraraṃ ghantaṃ haviṣo vītaye me |
Translation: 2 The gladdening juices stand prepared before you: come quickly and partake of mine oblation.

Sanskit Text: तिरो अर्यो हवनानि शरुतं नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tiro aryo havanāni śrutaṃ naḥ ||
Translation: Pass by the calling of our foe and bear us.

Sanskit Text: पर वां रथो मनोजवा इयर्ति तिरो रजांस्यश्विना शतोतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vāṃ ratho manojavā iyarti tiro rajāṃsyaśvinā śatotiḥ |
Translation: 3 Your chariot with a hundred aids, O Aśvins, beareth you swift as thought across the regions,

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं सूर्यावसू इयानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ sūryāvasū iyānaḥ ||
Translation: Speeding to us, O ye whose wealth is Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: अयं ह यद वां देवया उ अद्रिरूर्ध्वो विवक्ति सोमसुद युवभ्याम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ ha yad vāṃ devayā u adrirūrdhvo vivakti somasud yuvabhyām |
Translation: 4 What time this stone of yours, the Gods’ adorer, upraised, sounds forth for you as Soma-presser,

Sanskit Text: आ वल्गू विप्रो वव्र्तीत हव्यैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā valghū vipro vavṛtīta havyaiḥ ||
Translation: Let the priest bring you, Fair Ones, through oblations.

Sanskit Text: चित्रं ह यद वां भोजनं नवस्ति नयत्रये महिष्वन्तं युयोतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: citraṃ ha yad vāṃ bhojanaṃ nvasti nyatraye mahiṣvantaṃ yuyotam |
Translation: 5 The nourishment ye have is, truly, wondrous: ye gave thereof a quickening store to Atri,

Sanskit Text: यो वामोमानं दधते परियः सन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vāmomānaṃ dadhate priyaḥ san ||
Translation: Who being dear to you, receives your favour.

Sanskit Text: उत तयद वां जुरते अश्विना भूच्च्यवानाय परतीत्यं हविर्दे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tyad vāṃ jurate aśvinā bhūccyavānāya pratītyaṃ havirde |
Translation: 6 That gift, which all may gain, ye gave Cyavāna, when he grew old, who offered you oblations,

Sanskit Text: अधि यद वर्प इतूति धत्थः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi yad varpa itaūti dhatthaḥ ||
Translation: When ye bestowed on him enduring beauty.

Sanskit Text: उत तयं भुज्युमश्विना सखायो मध्ये जहुर्दुरेवासः समुद्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tyaṃ bhujyumaśvinā sakhāyo madhye jahurdurevāsaḥ samudre |
Translation: 7 What time his wicked friends abandoned Bhujyu, O Aśvins, in the middle of the ocean,

Sanskit Text: निरीं पर्षदरावा यो युवाकुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nirīṃ parṣadarāvā yo yuvākuḥ ||
Translation: Your horse delivered him, your faithful servant.

Sanskit Text: वर्काय चिज्जसमानाय शक्तमुत शरुतं शयवे हूयमाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛkāya cijjasamānāya śaktamuta śrutaṃ śayave hūyamānā |
Translation: 8 Ye lent your aid to Vrka when exhausted, and listened when invoked to Śayu's calling.

Sanskit Text: यावघ्न्यामपिन्वतमपो न सतर्यं चिच्छक्त्यश्विनाशचीभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāvaghnyāmapinvatamapo na staryaṃ cicchaktyaśvināśacībhiḥ ||
Translation: Ye made the cow pour forth her milk like water, and, Aśvins, strengthened with your strength the barren.

Sanskit Text: एष सय कारुर्जरते सूक्तैरग्रे बुधान उषसां सुमन्मा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa sya kārurjarate sūktairaghre budhāna uṣasāṃ sumanmā |
Translation: 9 With his fair hymns this singer, too, extols you, waking with glad thoughts at the break of morning.

Sanskit Text: इषा तं वर्धदघ्न्या पयोभिर्यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣā taṃ vardhadaghnyā payobhiryūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: May the cow nourish him with milk to feed llim. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: आ विश्ववाराश्विना गतं नः पर तत सथानमवाचि वां पर्थिव्याम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā viśvavārāśvinā ghataṃ naḥ pra tat sthānamavāci vāṃ pṛthivyām |
Translation: 1. RICH in all blessings, Aśvins come ye hither: this place on earth is called your own possession,

Sanskit Text: अश्वो न वाजी शुनप्र्ष्ठो अस्थादा यत सेदथुर्ध्रुवसे न योनिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvo na vājī śunapṛṣṭho asthādā yat sedathurdhruvase na yonim ||
Translation: Like a strong horse with a fair back it standeth, whereon, as in a lap, ye seat you firmly.

Sanskit Text: सिषक्ति सा वां सुमतिश्चनिष्ठातापि घर्मो मनुषो दुरोणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: siṣakti sā vāṃ sumatiścaniṣṭhātāpi gharmo manuṣo duroṇe |
Translation: 2 This most delightful eulogy awaits you in the man's house drink-offering hath been heated,

Sanskit Text: यो वां समुद्रान सरितः पिपर्त्येतग्वा चिन न सुयुजा युजानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vāṃ samudrān saritaḥ pipartyetaghvā cin na suyujā yujānaḥ ||
Translation: Which bringeth you over the seas and rivers, yoking as’twere two well-matched shining horses.

Sanskit Text: यानि सथानान्यश्विना दधाथे दिवो यह्वीष्वोषधीषु विक्षु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāni sthānānyaśvinā dadhāthe divo yahvīṣvoṣadhīṣu vikṣu |
Translation: 3 Whatever dwellings ye possess, O Aśvins, in fields of men or in the streams of heaven,

Sanskit Text: नि पर्वतस्य मूर्धनि सदन्तेषं जनाय दाशुषेवहन्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni parvatasya mūrdhani sadanteṣaṃ janāya dāśuṣevahantā ||
Translation: Resting upon the summit of the mountain, or bringing food to him who gives oblation,

Sanskit Text: चनिष्टं देवा ओषधीष्वप्सु यद योग्या अश्नवैथे रषीणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: caniṣṭaṃ devā oṣadhīṣvapsu yad yoghyā aśnavaithe ṛṣīṇām |
Translation: 4 Delight yourselves, ye Gods, in plants and waters when Ṛṣis give them and ye find they suit You.

Sanskit Text: पुरूणि रत्ना दधतौ नयस्मे अनु पूर्वाणि चख्यथुर्युगानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purūṇi ratnā dadhatau nyasme anu pūrvāṇi cakhyathuryughāni ||
Translation: Enriching us with treasures in abundance ye have looked back to former generations.

Sanskit Text: शुश्रुवांसा चिदश्विना पुरूण्यभि बरह्माणि चक्षाथे रषीणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuśruvāṃsā cidaśvinā purūṇyabhi brahmāṇi cakṣāthe ṛṣīṇām |
Translation: 5 Aśvins, though ye have heard them oft aforetime, regard the many prayers which Ṛṣis offer.

Sanskit Text: परति पर यातं वरमा जनायास्मे वामस्तु सुमतिश्चनिष्ठा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati pra yātaṃ varamā janāyāsme vāmastu sumatiścaniṣṭhā ||
Translation: Come to the man even as his heart desireth: may we enjoy your most delightful favour.

Sanskit Text: यो वां यज्ञो नासत्या हविष्मान कर्तब्रह्मा समर्यो भवाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vāṃ yajño nāsatyā haviṣmān kṛtabrahmā samaryo bhavāti |
Translation: 6 Come to the sacrifice offered you, Nāsatyas, with men, oblations, and prayer duly uttered.

Sanskit Text: उप पर यातं वरमा वसिष्ठमिमा बरह्माण्य रच्यन्ते युवभ्याम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa pra yātaṃ varamā vasiṣṭhamimā brahmāṇy ṛcyante yuvabhyām ||
Translation: Come to Vasiṣṭha as his heart desireth, for unto you these holy hymns are chanted.

Sanskit Text: इयं मनीषा इयमश्विना गीरिमां सुव्र्क्तिं वर्षणा जुषेथाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyaṃ manīṣā iyamaśvinā ghīrimāṃ suvṛktiṃ vṛṣaṇā juṣethām |
Translation: 7 This is the thought, this is the song, O Aśvins: accept this hymn of ours, ye Steers, with favour.

Sanskit Text: इमा बरह्माणि युवयून्यग्मन यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā brahmāṇi yuvayūnyaghman yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: May these our prayers addressed to you come nigh you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: आ गोमता नासत्या रथेनाश्वावता पुरुश्चन्द्रेण यातम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ghomatā nāsatyā rathenāśvāvatā puruścandreṇa yātam |
Translation: 1. COME, O Nāsatyas, on your car resplendent, rich in abundant wealth of kine and horses.

Sanskit Text: अभि वां विश्वा नियुतः सचन्ते सपार्हया शरिया तन्वा शुभाना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi vāṃ viśvā niyutaḥ sacante spārhayā śriyā tanvā śubhānā ||
Translation: As harnessed steeds, all our laudations follow you whose forms shine with most delightful beauty.

Sanskit Text: आ नो देवेभिरुप यातमर्वाक सजोषसा नासत्या रथेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no devebhirupa yātamarvāk sajoṣasā nāsatyā rathena |
Translation: 2 Come with the Gods associate, come ye hither to us, Nāsatyas, with your car accordant.

Sanskit Text: युवोर्हि नः सख्या पित्र्याणि समानो बन्धुरुत तस्य वित्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvorhi naḥ sakhyā pitryāṇi samāno bandhuruta tasya vittam ||
Translation: 'Twixt you and us there is ancestral friendship and common kin: remember and regard it.

Sanskit Text: उदु सतोमासो अश्विनोरबुध्रञ जामि बरह्माण्युषसश्च देवीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udu stomāso aśvinorabudhrañ jāmi brahmāṇyuṣasaśca devīḥ |
Translation: 3 Awakened are the songs that praise the Aśvins, the kindred prayers and the Celestial Mornings.

Sanskit Text: आविवासन रोदसी धिष्ण्येमे अछा विप्रो नासत्या विवक्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvivāsan rodasī dhiṣṇyeme achā vipro nāsatyā vivakti ||
Translation: Inviting those we long for, Earth and Heaven, the singer calleth these Nāsatyas hither.

Sanskit Text: वि चेदुछन्त्यश्विना उषासः पर वां बरह्माणि कारवो भरन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi ceduchantyaśvinā uṣāsaḥ pra vāṃ brahmāṇi kāravo bharante |
Translation: 4 What time the Dawns break forth in light, O Aśvins, to you the poets offer their devotions.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वं भानुं सविता देवो अश्रेद बर्हदग्नयः समिधा जरन्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvaṃ bhānuṃ savitā devo aśred bṛhadaghnayaḥ samidhā jarante ||
Translation: God Savitar hath sent aloft his splendour, and fires sing praises with the kindled fuel.

Sanskit Text: आ पश्चातान नासत्या पुरस्तादाश्विना यातमधरादुदक्तात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā paścātān nāsatyā purastādāśvinā yātamadharādudaktāt |
Translation: 5 Come from the west, come from the cast, Nāsatyas, come, Aśvins, from below and from above us.

Sanskit Text: आ विश्वतः पाञ्चजन्येन राया यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā viśvataḥ pāñcajanyena rāyā yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Bring wealth from all sides for the Fivefold People. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: इमा उ वां दिविष्टय उस्रा हवन्ते अश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā u vāṃ diviṣṭaya usrā havante aśvinā |
Translation: 1. THESE morning sacrifices call you, Aśvins, at the break of day.

Sanskit Text: अयं वामह्वे.अवसे शचीवसू विशं-विशं हि गछथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ vāmahve.avase śacīvasū viśaṃ-viśaṃ hi ghachathaḥ ||
Translation: For help have I invoked you rich in power and might: for, house by house ye visit all.

Sanskit Text: युवं चित्रं ददथुर्भोजनं नरा चोदेथां सून्र्तावते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ citraṃ dadathurbhojanaṃ narā codethāṃ sūnṛtāvate |
Translation: 2 O Heroes, ye bestow wonderful nourishment. send it to him whose songs are sweet

Sanskit Text: अर्वाग रथं समनसा नि यछतं पिबतं सोम्यं मधु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāgh rathaṃ samanasā ni yachataṃ pibataṃ somyaṃ madhu ||
Translation: Accordant, both of you, drive your car down to us, and drink the savoury Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: आ यातमुप भूषतं मध्वः पिबतमश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yātamupa bhūṣataṃ madhvaḥ pibatamaśvinā |
Translation: 3 Approach ye and be near to us. drink, O ye Aśvins, of the meath.

Sanskit Text: दुग्धं पयोव्र्षणा जेन्यावसू मा नो मर्धिष्टमा गतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dughdhaṃ payovṛṣaṇā jenyāvasū mā no mardhiṣṭamā ghatam ||
Translation: Draw forth the milk, ye Mighty, rich in genuine wealth: injure us not, and come to us.

Sanskit Text: अश्वासो ये वामुप दाशुषो गर्हं युवां दीयन्ति बिभ्रतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvāso ye vāmupa dāśuṣo ghṛhaṃ yuvāṃ dīyanti bibhrataḥ |
Translation: 4 The horses that convey you in their rapid flight down to the worshipper's abode,

Sanskit Text: मक्षूयुभिर्नरा हयेभिरश्विना देवा यातमस्मयू ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: makṣūyubhirnarā hayebhiraśvinā devā yātamasmayū ||
Translation: With these your speedy coursers, Heroes, Aśvins, come, ye Gods, come well-inclined to us.

Sanskit Text: अधा ह यन्तो अश्विना पर्क्षः सचन्त सूरयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā ha yanto aśvinā pṛkṣaḥ sacanta sūrayaḥ |
Translation: 5 Yea, verily, our princes seek the Aśvins in pursuit of food.

Sanskit Text: ता यंसतो मघवद्भ्यो धरुवं यशश्छर्दिरस्मभ्यं नासत्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā yaṃsato maghavadbhyo dhruvaṃ yaśaśchardirasmabhyaṃ nāsatyā ||
Translation: These shall give lasting glory to our liberal lords, and, both Nāsatyas, shelter us.

Sanskit Text: पर ये ययुरव्र्कासो रथा इव नर्पातारो जनानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ye yayuravṛkāso rathā iva nṛpātāro janānām |
Translation: 6 Those who have led the way, like cars, offending none, those who are guardians of the men-

Sanskit Text: उत सवेन शवसा शूशुवुर्नर उत कषियन्ति सुक्षितिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta svena śavasā śūśuvurnara uta kṣiyanti sukṣitim ||
Translation: Also through their own might the heroes have grown strong, and dwell in safe and happy homes.

Sanskit Text: वयुषा आवो दिविजा रतेनाविष्क्र्ण्वाना महिमानमागात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyuṣā āvo divijā ṛtenāviṣkṛṇvānā mahimānamāghāt |
Translation: 1. BORN in the heavens the Dawn hath flushed, and showing her majesty is come as Law ordaineth.

Sanskit Text: अप दरुहस्तम आवरजुष्टमङगिरस्तमा पथ्या अजीगः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa druhastama āvarajuṣṭamaṅghirastamā pathyā ajīghaḥ ||
Translation: She hath uncovered fiends and hateful darkness; best of Aṅgirases, hath waked the pathways.

Sanskit Text: महे नो अद्य सुविताय बोध्युषो महे सौभगाय पर यन्धि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahe no adya suvitāya bodhyuṣo mahe saubhaghāya pra yandhi |
Translation: 2 Rouse us this day to high and happy fortune: to great felicity, O Dawn, promote us.

Sanskit Text: चित्रं रयिं यशसं धेह्यस्मे देवि मर्तेषु मानुषि शरवस्युम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: citraṃ rayiṃ yaśasaṃ dhehyasme devi marteṣu mānuṣi śravasyum ||
Translation: Vouchsafe us manifold and splendid riches, famed among mortals, man-befriending Goddess!

Sanskit Text: एते तये भानवो दर्शतायाश्चित्रा उषसो अम्र्तास आगुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete tye bhānavo darśatāyāścitrā uṣaso amṛtāsa āghuḥ |
Translation: 3 See, lovely Morning's everlasting splendours, bright with their varied colours, have approached us.

Sanskit Text: जनयन्तो दैव्यानि वरतान्याप्र्णन्तो अन्तरिक्षा वयस्थुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: janayanto daivyāni vratānyāpṛṇanto antarikṣā vyasthuḥ ||
Translation: Filling the region of mid-air, producing the rites of holy worship, they have mounted.

Sanskit Text: एषा सया युजाना पराकात पञ्च कषितीः परि सद्यो जिगाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣā syā yujānā parākāt pañca kṣitīḥ pari sadyo jighāti |
Translation: 4 She yokes her chariot far away, and swiftly visits the lands where the Five Tribes are settled,

Sanskit Text: अभिपश्यन्ती वयुना जनानां दिवो दुहिता भुवनस्यपत्नी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhipaśyantī vayunā janānāṃ divo duhitā bhuvanasyapatnī ||
Translation: Looking upon the works and ways of mortals, Daughter of Heaven, the world's Imperial Lady.

Sanskit Text: वाजिनीवती सूर्यस्य योषा चित्रामघा राय ईशे वसूनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājinīvatī sūryasya yoṣā citrāmaghā rāya īśe vasūnām |
Translation: 5 She who is rich in spoil, the Spouse of Sūrya, wondrously opulent, rules all wealth and treasures.

Sanskit Text: रषिष्टुता जरयन्ती मघोन्युषा उछति वह्निभिर्ग्र्णाना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṣiṣṭutā jarayantī maghonyuṣā uchati vahnibhirghṛṇānā ||
Translation: Consumer of our youth, the seers extol her: lauded by priests rich Dawn shines out refulgent.

Sanskit Text: परति दयुतानामरुषासो अश्वाश्चित्रा अद्र्श्रन्नुषसं वहन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati dyutānāmaruṣāso aśvāścitrā adṛśrannuṣasaṃ vahantaḥ |
Translation: 6 Apparent are the steeds of varied colour, the red steeds carrying resplendent Morning.

Sanskit Text: याति शुभ्रा विश्वपिशा रथेन दधाति रत्नंविधते जनाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāti śubhrā viśvapiśā rathena dadhāti ratnaṃvidhate janāya ||
Translation: On her all-lovely car she comes, the Fair One, and brings rich treasure for her faithful servant.

Sanskit Text: सत्या सत्येभिर्महती महद्भिर्देवी देवेभिर्यजता यजत्रैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satyā satyebhirmahatī mahadbhirdevī devebhiryajatā yajatraiḥ |
Translation: 7 True with the True and Mighty with the Mighty, with Gods a Goddess, Holy with the Holy,

Sanskit Text: रुजद दर्ळ्हानि दददुस्रियाणां परति गाव उषसं वावशन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rujad dṛḷhāni dadadusriyāṇāṃ prati ghāva uṣasaṃ vāvaśanta ||
Translation: She brake strong fences down and gave the cattle: the kine were lowing as they greeted Morning.

Sanskit Text: नू नो गोमद वीरवद धेहि रत्नमुषो अश्वावद पुरुभोजो अस्मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū no ghomad vīravad dhehi ratnamuṣo aśvāvad purubhojo asme |
Translation: 8 O Dawn, now give us wealth in kine and heroes, and horses, fraught with manifold enjoyment.

Sanskit Text: मा नो बर्हिः पुरुषता निदे कर्यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no barhiḥ puruṣatā nide karyūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Protect our sacred grass from man's reproaches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: उदु जयोतिरम्र्तं विश्वजन्यं विश्वानरः सविता देवो अश्रेत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udu jyotiramṛtaṃ viśvajanyaṃ viśvānaraḥ savitā devo aśret |
Translation: 1. SAVITAR God of all men hath sent upward his light, designed for all mankind, immortal.

Sanskit Text: करत्वा देवानामजनिष्ट चक्षुराविरकर्भुवनंविश्वमुषाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratvā devānāmajaniṣṭa cakṣurāvirakarbhuvanaṃviśvamuṣāḥ ||
Translation: Through the Gods’ power that Eye was first created. Dawn hath made all the universe apparent.

Sanskit Text: पर मे पन्था देवयाना अद्र्श्रन्नमर्धन्तो वसुभिरिष्क्र्तासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra me panthā devayānā adṛśrannamardhanto vasubhiriṣkṛtāsaḥ |
Translation: 2 I see the paths which Gods are wont to travel, innocuous paths made ready by the Vasus.

Sanskit Text: अभूदु केतुरुषसः पुरस्तात परतीच्यागादधि हर्म्येभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhūdu keturuṣasaḥ purastāt pratīcyāghādadhi harmyebhyaḥ ||
Translation: Eastward the flag of Dawn hath been uplifted; she hath come hither o’er the tops of houses.

Sanskit Text: तानीदहानि बहुलान्यासन या पराचीनमुदिता सूर्यस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tānīdahāni bahulānyāsan yā prācīnamuditā sūryasya |
Translation: 3 Great is, in truth, the number of the Mornings which were aforetime at the Sun's uprising.

Sanskit Text: यतः परि जार इवाचरन्त्युषो दद्र्क्षे न पुनर्यतीव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yataḥ pari jāra ivācarantyuṣo dadṛkṣe na punaryatīva ||
Translation: Since thou, O Dawn, hast been beheld repairing as to thy love, as one no more to leave him.

Sanskit Text: त इद देवानां सधमाद आसन्न्र्तावानः कवयः पूर्व्यासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta id devānāṃ sadhamāda āsannṛtāvānaḥ kavayaḥ pūrvyāsaḥ |
Translation: 4 They were the Gods’ companions at the banquet, the ancient sages true to Law Eternal.

Sanskit Text: गूळ्हं जयोतिः पितरो अन्वविन्दन सत्यमन्त्रा अजनयन्नुषासम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghūḷhaṃ jyotiḥ pitaro anvavindan satyamantrā ajanayannuṣāsam ||
Translation: The Fathers found the light that lay in darkness, and with effectual words begat the Morning.

Sanskit Text: समान ऊर्वे अधि संगतासः सं जानते न यतन्ते मिथस्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samāna ūrve adhi saṃghatāsaḥ saṃ jānate na yatante mithaste |
Translation: 5 Meeting together in the same enclosure, they strive not, ofone mind, one with another.

Sanskit Text: ते देवानां न मिनन्ति वरतान्यमर्धन्तो वसुभिर्यादमानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te devānāṃ na minanti vratānyamardhanto vasubhiryādamānāḥ ||
Translation: They never break the Gods’ eternal statutes, and injure none, in rivalry with Vasus.

Sanskit Text: परति तवा सतोमैरीळते वसिष्ठा उषर्बुधः सुभगे तुष्टुवांसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati tvā stomairīḷate vasiṣṭhā uṣarbudhaḥ subhaghe tuṣṭuvāṃsaḥ |
Translation: 6 Extolling thee, Blest Goddess, the Vasisthas, awake at early mom, with lauds implore thee.

Sanskit Text: गवां नेत्री वाजपत्नी न उछोषः सुजाते परथमा जरस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghavāṃ netrī vājapatnī na uchoṣaḥ sujāte prathamā jarasva ||
Translation: Leader of kine and Queen of all that strengthens, shine, come as first to us, O high-born Morning.

Sanskit Text: एषा नेत्री राधसः सून्र्तानामुषा उछन्ती रिभ्यते वसिष्ठैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣā netrī rādhasaḥ sūnṛtānāmuṣā uchantī ribhyate vasiṣṭhaiḥ |
Translation: 7 She bringeth bounty and sweet charm of voices. The flushing Dawn is sung by the Vasisthas,

Sanskit Text: दीर्घश्रुतं रयिमस्मे दधाना यूयं पात . .. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dīrghaśrutaṃ rayimasme dadhānā yūyaṃ pāta . .. ||
Translation: Giving us riches famed to distant places. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: उपो रुरुचे युवतिर्न योषा विश्वं जीवं परसुवन्ती चरायै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upo ruruce yuvatirna yoṣā viśvaṃ jīvaṃ prasuvantī carāyai |
Translation: 1. SHE hath shone brightly like a youthful woman, stirring to motion every living creature.

Sanskit Text: अभूदग्निः समिधे मानुषाणामकर्ज्योतिर्बाधमाना तमांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhūdaghniḥ samidhe mānuṣāṇāmakarjyotirbādhamānā tamāṃsi ||
Translation: Agni hath come to feed on mortal? fuel. She hath made light and chased away the darkness.

Sanskit Text: विश्वं परतीची सप्रथा उदस्थाद रुशद वासो बिभ्रतीशुक्रमश्वैत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvaṃ pratīcī saprathā udasthād ruśad vāso bibhratīśukramaśvait |
Translation: 2 Turned to this All, far-spreading, she hath risen and shone in brightness with white robes about her.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यवर्णा सुद्र्शीकसन्द्र्ग गवां मातानेत्र्यह्नामरोचि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyavarṇā sudṛśīkasandṛgh ghavāṃ mātānetryahnāmaroci ||
Translation: She hath beamed forth lovely with golden colours, Mother of kine, Guide of the days she bringeth.

Sanskit Text: देवानां चक्षुः सुभगा वहन्ती शवेतं नयन्ती सुद्र्शीकमश्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānāṃ cakṣuḥ subhaghā vahantī śvetaṃ nayantī sudṛśīkamaśvam |
Translation: 3 Bearing the Gods’ own Eye, auspicious Lady, leading her Courser white and fair to look on,

Sanskit Text: उषा अदर्शि रश्मिभिर्व्यक्ता चित्रामघा विश्वमनु परभूता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣā adarśi raśmibhirvyaktā citrāmaghā viśvamanu prabhūtā ||
Translation: Distinguished by her bean-is Dawn shines apparent, come forth to all the world with wondrous treasure.

Sanskit Text: अन्तिवामा दूरे अमित्रमुछोर्वीं गव्यूतिमभयं कर्धी नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: antivāmā dūre amitramuchorvīṃ ghavyūtimabhayaṃ kṛdhī naḥ |
Translation: 4 Draw nigh with wealth and dawn away the foeman: prepare for us wide pasture free from danger.

Sanskit Text: यावय दवेष आ भरा वसूनि चोदय राधो गर्णते मघोनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāvaya dveṣa ā bharā vasūni codaya rādho ghṛṇate maghoni ||
Translation: Drive away those who hate us, bring us riches: pour bounty, opulent Lady, on the singer.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे शरेष्ठेभिर्भानुभिर्वि भाह्युषो देवि परतिरन्ती न आयुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme śreṣṭhebhirbhānubhirvi bhāhyuṣo devi pratirantī na āyuḥ |
Translation: 5 Send thy most excellent beams to shine and light us, giving us lengthened days, O Dawn, O Goddess,

Sanskit Text: इषं च नो दधती विश्ववारे गोमदश्वावद रथवच्च राधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣaṃ ca no dadhatī viśvavāre ghomadaśvāvad rathavacca rādhaḥ ||
Translation: Granting us food, thou who hast all things precious, and bounty rich in chariots, kine, and horses.

Sanskit Text: यां तवा दिवो दुहितर्वर्धयन्त्युषः सुजाते मतिभिर्वसिष्ठाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāṃ tvā divo duhitarvardhayantyuṣaḥ sujāte matibhirvasiṣṭhāḥ |
Translation: 6 O Uṣas, nobly-born, Daughter of Heaven, whom the Vasisthas with their hymns make mighty,

Sanskit Text: सास्मासु धा रयिं रष्वं बर्हन्तं यूयं पात .. . ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sāsmāsu dhā rayiṃ ṛṣvaṃ bṛhantaṃ yūyaṃ pāta .. . ||
Translation: Bestow thou on us vast and glorious riches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: परति केतवः परथमा अद्र्श्रन्नूर्ध्वा अस्या अञ्जयो वि शरयन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati ketavaḥ prathamā adṛśrannūrdhvā asyā añjayo vi śrayante |
Translation: 1. WE have beheld her earliest lights approaching: her many glories part, on high, asunder.

Sanskit Text: उषो अर्वाचा बर्हता रथेन जयोतिष्मता वाममस्मभ्यं वक्षि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣo arvācā bṛhatā rathena jyotiṣmatā vāmamasmabhyaṃ vakṣi ||
Translation: On car sublime, refulgent, wending hither, O Uṣas, bring the Wealth that makes us happy.

Sanskit Text: परति षीमग्निर्जरते समिद्धः परति विप्रासो मतिभिर्ग्र्णन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati ṣīmaghnirjarate samiddhaḥ prati viprāso matibhirghṛṇantaḥ |
Translation: 2 The fire well-kindIed sings aloud to greet her, and with their hymns the priests are chaming welcome.

Sanskit Text: उषा याति जयोतिषा बाधमाना विश्वा तमांसि दुरिताप देवी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣā yāti jyotiṣā bādhamānā viśvā tamāṃsi duritāpa devī ||
Translation: Uṣas approaches in her splendour, driving all evil darkness far away, the Goddess.

Sanskit Text: एता उ तयाः परत्यद्र्श्रन पुरस्ताज्ज्योतिर्यछन्तीरुषसोविभातीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etā u tyāḥ pratyadṛśran purastājjyotiryachantīruṣasovibhātīḥ |
Translation: 3 Apparent eastward are those lights of Morning, sending out lustre, as they rise, around them.

Sanskit Text: अजीजनन सूर्यं यज्ञमग्निमपाचीनं तमो अगादजुष्टम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajījanan sūryaṃ yajñamaghnimapācīnaṃ tamo aghādajuṣṭam ||
Translation: She hath brought forth Sun, sacrifice, and Agni, and far away hath fled detested darkness.

Sanskit Text: अचेति दिवो दुहिता मघोनी विश्वे पश्यन्त्युषसं विभातीम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aceti divo duhitā maghonī viśve paśyantyuṣasaṃ vibhātīm |
Translation: 4 Rich Daughter of the Sky, we all behold her, yea, all men look on Dawn as she is breaking.

Sanskit Text: आस्थाद रथं सवधया युज्यमानमा यमश्वासः सुयुजो वहन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsthād rathaṃ svadhayā yujyamānamā yamaśvāsaḥ suyujo vahanti ||
Translation: fler car that moves self-harnessed hath she mounted, the car drawn onward by her well-yoked horses.

Sanskit Text: परति तवाद्य सुमनसो बुधन्तास्माकासो मघवानो वयं च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati tvādya sumanaso budhantāsmākāso maghavāno vayaṃ ca |
Translation: 5 Inspired with loving thoughts this day to greet thee, we and our wealthy nobles have awakened.

Sanskit Text: तिल्विलायध्वमुषसो विभातीर्यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tilvilāyadhvamuṣaso vibhātīryūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Show yourselves fruitful, Dawns, as ye are rising. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: वयुषा आवः पथ्या जनानां पञ्च कषितीर्मानुषीर्बोधयन्ती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyuṣā āvaḥ pathyā janānāṃ pañca kṣitīrmānuṣīrbodhayantī |
Translation: 1. ROUSING the lands where men's Five Tribes are settled, Dawn hath disclosed the pathways of the people.

Sanskit Text: सुसन्द्र्ग्भिरुक्षभिर्भानुमश्रेद वि सूर्यो रोदसी चक्षसावः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: susandṛghbhirukṣabhirbhānumaśred vi sūryo rodasī cakṣasāvaḥ ||
Translation: She hath sent out her sheen with beauteous oxen. The Sun with light hath opened earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: वयञ्जते दिवो अन्तेष्वक्तून विशो न युक्ता उषसो यतन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyañjate divo anteṣvaktūn viśo na yuktā uṣaso yatante |
Translation: 2 They paint their bright rays on the sky's far limits. the Dawns come on like tribes arrayed for battle.

Sanskit Text: सं ते गावस्तम आ वर्तयन्ति जयोतिर्यछन्ति सवितेव बाहू ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ te ghāvastama ā vartayanti jyotiryachanti saviteva bāhū ||
Translation: Thy cattle, closely shutting up the darkness, as Savitar spreads his arms, give forth their lustre.

Sanskit Text: अभूदुषा इन्द्रतमा मघोन्यजीजनत सुविताय शरवांसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhūduṣā indratamā maghonyajījanat suvitāya śravāṃsi |
Translation: 3 Wealthy, most like to Indra, Dawn hath risen, and brought forth lauds that shall promote our welfare.

Sanskit Text: वि दिवो देवी दुहिता दधात्यङगिरस्तमा सुक्र्ते वसूनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi divo devī duhitā dadhātyaṅghirastamā sukṛte vasūni ||
Translation: Daughter of Heaven, a Goddess, she distributes, best of Aṅgirases, treasures to the pious.

Sanskit Text: तावदुषो राधो अस्मभ्यं रास्व यावत सतोत्र्भ्यो अरदो गर्णाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāvaduṣo rādho asmabhyaṃ rāsva yāvat stotṛbhyo arado ghṛṇānā |
Translation: 4 Bestow on us, O Dawn, that ample bounty which thou didst send to those who sang thy praises;

Sanskit Text: यां तवा जज्ञुर्व्र्षभस्या रवेण वि दर्ळ्हस्य दुरो अद्रेरौर्णोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāṃ tvā jajñurvṛṣabhasyā raveṇa vi dṛḷhasya duro adreraurṇoḥ ||
Translation: Thou whom with bellowings of a bull they quickened: thou didst unbar the firm-set mountain's portals.

Sanskit Text: देवं-देवं राधसे चोदयन्त्यस्मद्र्यक सून्र्ता ईरयन्ती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devaṃ-devaṃ rādhase codayantyasmadryak sūnṛtā īrayantī |
Translation: 5 Impelling every God to grant his bounty sending to us the charm of pleasant voices,

Sanskit Text: वयुछन्ती नः सनये धियो धा यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyuchantī naḥ sanaye dhiyo dhā yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Vouchsafe us thoughts, for profit, as thou breakest. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: परत्यु अदर्श्यायत्युछन्ती दुहिता दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratyu adarśyāyatyuchantī duhitā divaḥ |
Translation: 1. ADVANCING, sending forth her rays, the Daughter of the Sky is seen.

Sanskit Text: अपो महि वययति चक्षसे तमो जयोतिष कर्णोति सूनरी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apo mahi vyayati cakṣase tamo jyotiṣ kṛṇoti sūnarī ||
Translation: Uncovering, that we may see, the mighty gloom, the friendly Lady makes the light.
