Sanskit Text: उदुस्रियाः सर्जते सूर्यः सचानुद्यन नक्षत्रमर्चिवत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udusriyāḥ sṛjate sūryaḥ sacānudyan nakṣatramarcivat |
Translation: 2 The Sun ascending, the refulgent Star, pours down his beams together with the Dawn.

Sanskit Text: तवेदुषो वयुषि सूर्यस्य च सं भक्तेन गमेमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taveduṣo vyuṣi sūryasya ca saṃ bhaktena ghamemahi ||
Translation: O Dawn, at thine arising, and the Sun's, may we attain the share allotted us.

Sanskit Text: परति तवा दुहितर्दिव उषो जीरा अभुत्स्महि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati tvā duhitardiva uṣo jīrā abhutsmahi |
Translation: 3 Promptly we woke to welcome thee, O Uṣas, Daughter of the Sky,

Sanskit Text: या वहसि पुरुस्पार्हं वनन्वति रत्नं न दाशुषे मयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā vahasi puruspārhaṃ vananvati ratnaṃ na dāśuṣe mayaḥ ||
Translation: Thee, Bounteous One, who bringest all we long to have, and to the offerer health and wealth.

Sanskit Text: उछन्ती या कर्णोषि मंहना महि परख्यै देवि सवर्द्र्शे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uchantī yā kṛṇoṣi maṃhanā mahi prakhyai devi svardṛśe |
Translation: 4 Thou, dawning, workest fain to light the great world, yea, heaven, Goddess! that it may be seen.

Sanskit Text: तस्यास्ते रत्नभाज ईमहे वयं सयाम मातुर्न सूनवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasyāste ratnabhāja īmahe vayaṃ syāma māturna sūnavaḥ ||
Translation: We yearn to be thine own, Dealer of Wealth: may we be to this Mother like her sons.

Sanskit Text: तच्चित्रं राध आ भरोषो यद दीर्घश्रुत्तमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taccitraṃ rādha ā bharoṣo yad dīrghaśruttamam |
Translation: 5 Bring us that wondrous bounty, Dawn, that shall be famed most far away.

Sanskit Text: यत तेदिवो दुहितर्मर्तभोजनं तद रास्व भुनजामहै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat tedivo duhitarmartabhojanaṃ tad rāsva bhunajāmahai ||
Translation: What, Child of Heaven, thou hast of nourishment for man, bestow thou on us to enjoy.

Sanskit Text: शरवः सूरिभ्यो अम्र्तं वसुत्वनं वाजानस्मभ्यं गोमतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śravaḥ sūribhyo amṛtaṃ vasutvanaṃ vājānasmabhyaṃ ghomataḥ |
Translation: 6 Give to our princes opulence and immortal fame, and strength in herds of kine to us.

Sanskit Text: चोदयित्री मघोनः सून्र्तावत्युषा उछदप सरिधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: codayitrī maghonaḥ sūnṛtāvatyuṣā uchadapa sridhaḥ ||
Translation: May she who prompts the wealthy, Lady of sweet strains, may Uṣas dawn our foes away.

Sanskit Text: आ वां राजानावध्वरे वव्र्त्यां हव्येभिरिन्द्रावरुणा नमोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ rājānāvadhvare vavṛtyāṃ havyebhirindrāvaruṇā namobhiḥ |
Translation: 1. KINGS, Indra-Varuṇa, I would turn you hither to this our sacrifice with gifts and homage.

Sanskit Text: पर वां घर्ताची बाह्वोर्दधाना परि तमना विषुरूपा जिगाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vāṃ ghṛtācī bāhvordadhānā pari tmanā viṣurūpā jighāti ||
Translation: Held in both arms the ladle, dropping fatness, goes of itself to you whose forms are varied.

Sanskit Text: युवो राष्ट्रं बर्हदिन्वति दयौर्यौ सेत्र्भिररज्जुभिः सिनीथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvo rāṣṭraṃ bṛhadinvati dyauryau setṛbhirarajjubhiḥ sinīthaḥ |
Translation: 2 Dyaus quickens and promotes your high dominion who bind with bonds not wrought of rope or cordage.

Sanskit Text: परि नो हेळो वरुणस्य वर्ज्या उरुं न इन्द्रः कर्णवदु लोकम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari no heḷo varuṇasya vṛjyā uruṃ na indraḥ kṛṇavadu lokam ||
Translation: Far from us still be Varuṇa's displeasure may Indra give us spacious room to dwell in.

Sanskit Text: कर्तं नो यज्ञं विदथेषु चारुं कर्तं बरह्माणि सूरिषुप्रशस्ता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛtaṃ no yajñaṃ vidatheṣu cāruṃ kṛtaṃ brahmāṇi sūriṣupraśastā |
Translation: 3 Make ye our sacrifice fair amid the assemblies: make ye our prayers approved among our princes.

Sanskit Text: उपो रयिर्देवजूतो न एतु पर णः सपार्हाभिरूतिभिस्तिरेतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upo rayirdevajūto na etu pra ṇaḥ spārhābhirūtibhistiretam ||
Translation: May God-sent riches come for our possession: further ye us with your delightful succours.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे इन्द्रावरुणा विश्ववारं रयिं धत्तं वसुमन्तं पुरुक्षुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme indrāvaruṇā viśvavāraṃ rayiṃ dhattaṃ vasumantaṃ purukṣum |
Translation: 4 O Indra-Varuṇa, vouchsafe us riches with store of treasure, food, and every blessing;

Sanskit Text: पर य आदित्यो अन्र्ता मिनात्यमिता शूरो दयते वसूनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ya ādityo anṛtā minātyamitā śūro dayate vasūni ||
Translation: For the Āditya, banisher of falsehood, the Hero, dealeth wealth in boundless plenty.

Sanskit Text: इयमिन्द्रं वरुणमष्ट मे गीः परावत तोके तनये तूतुजाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyamindraṃ varuṇamaṣṭa me ghīḥ prāvat toke tanaye tūtujānā |
Translation: 5 May this my song reach Varuṇa and Indra, and, strongly urging, win me sons and offspring.

Sanskit Text: सुरत्नासो देववीतिं गमेम यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suratnāso devavītiṃ ghamema yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: To the Gods’ banquet may we go with riches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: धीरा तवस्य महिना जनूंषि वि यस्तस्तम्भ रोदसी चिदुर्वी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhīrā tvasya mahinā janūṃṣi vi yastastambha rodasī cidurvī |
Translation: 1. WISE, verily, are creatures through his greatness who stayed ever, spacious heaven and earth asunder;

Sanskit Text: पर नाकं रष्वं नुनुदे बर्हन्तं दविता नक्षत्रम्पप्रथच्च भूम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra nākaṃ ṛṣvaṃ nunude bṛhantaṃ dvitā nakṣatrampaprathacca bhūma ||
Translation: Who urged the high and mighty sky to motion, the Star of old, and spread the earth before him.

Sanskit Text: उत सवया तन्वा सं वदे तत कदा नवन्तर्वरुणे भुवानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta svayā tanvā saṃ vade tat kadā nvantarvaruṇe bhuvāni |
Translation: 2 With mine own heart I commune on the question how Varuṇa and I may be united.

Sanskit Text: किं मे हव्यमह्र्णानो जुषेत कदा मर्ळीकं सुमना अभि खयम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kiṃ me havyamahṛṇāno juṣeta kadā mṛḷīkaṃ sumanā abhi khyam ||
Translation: What gift of mine will he accept unangered? When may I calmly look and find him gracious?

Sanskit Text: पर्छे तदेनो वरुण दिद्र्क्षूपो एमि चिकितुषो विप्र्छम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛche tadeno varuṇa didṛkṣūpo emi cikituṣo vipṛcham |
Translation: 3 Fain to know this is my sin I question others: I seek the wise, O Varuṇa, and ask them.

Sanskit Text: समानमिन मे कवयश्चिदाहुरयं ह तुभ्यं वरुणो हर्णीते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samānamin me kavayaścidāhurayaṃ ha tubhyaṃ varuṇo hṛṇīte ||
Translation: This one same answer even the sages gave me, "Surely this Varuṇa is angry with thee."

Sanskit Text: किमाग आस वरुण जयेष्ठं यत सतोतारं जिघांससि सखायम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kimāgha āsa varuṇa jyeṣṭhaṃ yat stotāraṃ jighāṃsasi sakhāyam |
Translation: 4 What, Varuṇa, hath been my chief transgression, that thou wouldst slay the friend who sings thy praises?

Sanskit Text: पर तन मे वोचो दूळभ सवधावो.अव तवानेना नमसा तुर इयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra tan me voco dūḷabha svadhāvo.ava tvānenā namasā tura iyām ||
Translation: Tell me, Unconquerable Lord, and quickly sinless will I approach thee with mine homage.

Sanskit Text: अव दरुग्धानि पित्र्या सर्जा नो.अव या वयं चक्र्मा तनूभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava drughdhāni pitryā sṛjā no.ava yā vayaṃ cakṛmā tanūbhiḥ |
Translation: 5 Free us from sins committed by our fathers, from those wherein we have ourselves offended.

Sanskit Text: अव राजन पशुत्र्पं न तायुं सर्जा वत्सं न दाम्नो वसिष्ठम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava rājan paśutṛpaṃ na tāyuṃ sṛjā vatsaṃ na dāmno vasiṣṭham ||
Translation: O King, loose, like a thief who feeds the cattle, as from the cord a calf, set free Vasiṣṭha.

Sanskit Text: न स सवो दक्षो वरुण धरुतिः सा सुरा मन्युर्विभीदकोचित्तिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na sa svo dakṣo varuṇa dhrutiḥ sā surā manyurvibhīdakoacittiḥ |
Translation: 6 Not our own will betrayed us, but seduction, thoughtlessness, Varuṇa wine, dice, or anger.

Sanskit Text: अस्ति जयायान कनीयस उपारे सवप्नश्चनेदन्र्तस्य परयोता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asti jyāyān kanīyasa upāre svapnaścanedanṛtasya prayotā ||
Translation: The old is near to lead astray the younger: even sleep removeth not all evil-doing.

Sanskit Text: अरं दासो न मीळ्हुषे कराण्यहं देवाय भूर्णये.अनागाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: araṃ dāso na mīḷhuṣe karāṇyahaṃ devāya bhūrṇaye.anāghāḥ |
Translation: 7 Slavelike may I do service to the Bounteous, serve, free from sin, the God inclined to anger.

Sanskit Text: अचेतयदचितो देवो अर्यो गर्त्सं राये कवितरो जुनाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: acetayadacito devo aryo ghṛtsaṃ rāye kavitaro junāti ||
Translation: This gentle Lord gives wisdom to the simple: the wiser God leads on the wise to riches.

Sanskit Text: अयं सु तुभ्यं वरुण सवधावो हर्दि सतोम उपश्रितश्चिदस्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ su tubhyaṃ varuṇa svadhāvo hṛdi stoma upaśritaścidastu |
Translation: 8 O Lord, O Varuṇa, may this laudation come close to thee and lie within thy spirit.

Sanskit Text: शं नः कषेमे शमु योगे नो अस्तु यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ naḥ kṣeme śamu yoghe no astu yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: May it be well with us in rest and labour. Preserve us ever-more, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: रदत पथो वरुणः सूर्याय परार्णांसि समुद्रिया नदीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: radat patho varuṇaḥ sūryāya prārṇāṃsi samudriyā nadīnām |
Translation: 1. VARUNA cut a pathway out for Sūrya, and led the watery floods of rivers onward.

Sanskit Text: सर्गो न सर्ष्टो अर्वतीरतायञ्चकार महीरवनीरहभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sargho na sṛṣṭo arvatīrtāyañcakāra mahīravanīrahabhyaḥ ||
Translation: The Mares, as in a race, speed on in order. He made great channels for the days to follow.

Sanskit Text: आत्मा ते वातो रज आ नवीनोत पशुर्न भूर्णिर्यवसे ससवान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ātmā te vāto raja ā navīnot paśurna bhūrṇiryavase sasavān |
Translation: 2 The wind, thy breath, hath sounded through the region like a wild beast that seeks his food in pastures.

Sanskit Text: अन्तर्मही बर्हती रोदसीमे विश्वा ते धाम वरुण परियाणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: antarmahī bṛhatī rodasīme viśvā te dhāma varuṇa priyāṇi ||
Translation: Within these two, exalted Earth and Heaven, O Varuṇa, are all the forms thou lovest.

Sanskit Text: परि सपशो वरुणस्य समदिष्टा उभे पश्यन्ति रोदसी सुमेके |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari spaśo varuṇasya smadiṣṭā ubhe paśyanti rodasī sumeke |
Translation: 3 Varuṇa's spies, sent forth upon their errand, survey the two world-halves well formed and fashioned.

Sanskit Text: रतावानः कवयो यज्ञधीराः परचेतसो य इषयन्त मन्म ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtāvānaḥ kavayo yajñadhīrāḥ pracetaso ya iṣayanta manma ||
Translation: Wise are they, holy, skilled in sacrifices, the furtherers of the praise-songs of the prudent.

Sanskit Text: उवाच मे वरुणो मेधिराय तरिः सप्त नामाघ्न्या बिभर्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uvāca me varuṇo medhirāya triḥ sapta nāmāghnyā bibharti |
Translation: 4 To me who understand hath Varuṇa spoken, the names borne by the Cow are three times seven.

Sanskit Text: विद्वान पदस्य गुह्या न वोचद युगाय विप्र उपराय शिक्षन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidvān padasya ghuhyā na vocad yughāya vipra uparāya śikṣan ||
Translation: The sapient God, knowing the place's secret, shall speak as ’twere to teach the race that cometh.

Sanskit Text: तिस्रो दयावो निहिता अन्तरस्मिन तिस्रो भूमीरुपराः षड्विधानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisro dyāvo nihitā antarasmin tisro bhūmīruparāḥ ṣaḍvidhānāḥ |
Translation: 5 On him three heavens rest and are supported, and the three earths are there in sixfold order.

Sanskit Text: गर्त्सो राजा वरुणश्चक्र एतं दिवि परेङखंहिरण्ययं शुभे कम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtso rājā varuṇaścakra etaṃ divi preṅkhaṃhiraṇyayaṃ śubhe kam ||
Translation: The wise King Varuṇa hath made in heaven that Golden Swing to cover it with glory.

Sanskit Text: अव सिन्धुं वरुणो दयौरिव सथाद दरप्सो न शवेतो मर्गस्तुविष्मान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava sindhuṃ varuṇo dyauriva sthād drapso na śveto mṛghastuviṣmān |
Translation: 6 Like Varuṇa from heaven he sinks in Sindhu, like a white-shining spark, a strong wild creature.

Sanskit Text: गम्भीरशंसो रजसो विमानः सुपारक्षत्रः सतो अस्य राजा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghambhīraśaṃso rajaso vimānaḥ supārakṣatraḥ sato asya rājā ||
Translation: Ruling in depths and meting out the region, great saving power hath he, this world's Controller.

Sanskit Text: यो मर्ळयाति चक्रुषे चिदागो वयं सयाम वरुणे अनागाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo mṛḷayāti cakruṣe cidāgho vayaṃ syāma varuṇe anāghāḥ |
Translation: 7 Before this Varuṇa may we be sinless him who shows mercy even to the sinner-

Sanskit Text: अनु वरतान्यदितेरधन्तो यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu vratānyaditerdhanto yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: While we are keeping Aditi's ordinances. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: पर शुन्ध्युवं वरुणाय परेष्ठां मतिं वसिष्ठ मीळ्हुषे भरस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra śundhyuvaṃ varuṇāya preṣṭhāṃ matiṃ vasiṣṭha mīḷhuṣe bharasva |
Translation: 1. PRESENT to Varuṇa thine hymn, Vasiṣṭha, bright, most delightful to the Bounteous Giver,

Sanskit Text: य ईमर्वाञ्चं करते यजत्रं सहस्रामघं वर्षणं बर्हन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya īmarvāñcaṃ karate yajatraṃ sahasrāmaghaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ bṛhantam ||
Translation: Who bringeth on to us the Bull, the lofty, the Holy, laden with a thousand treasures.

Sanskit Text: अधा नवस्य सन्द्र्शं जगन्वानग्नेरनीकं वरुणस्य मंसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā nvasya sandṛśaṃ jaghanvānaghneranīkaṃ varuṇasya maṃsi |
Translation: 2 And now, as I am come before his presence, I take the face of Varuṇa for Agni's.

Sanskit Text: सवर्यदश्मन्नधिपा उ अन्धो.अभि मा वपुर्द्र्शये निनीयात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svaryadaśmannadhipā u andho.abhi mā vapurdṛśaye ninīyāt ||
Translation: So might he bring-Lord also of the darkness-the light in heaven that I may see its beauty!

Sanskit Text: आ यद रुहाव वरुणश्च नावं पर यत समुद्रमीरयावमध्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yad ruhāva varuṇaśca nāvaṃ pra yat samudramīrayāvamadhyam |
Translation: 3 When Varuṇa and I embark together and urge our boat into the midst of ocean,

Sanskit Text: अधि यदपां सनुभिश्चराव पर परेङख ईङखयावहै शुभे कम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi yadapāṃ snubhiścarāva pra preṅkha īṅkhayāvahai śubhe kam ||
Translation: We, when we ride o’er ridges of the waters, will swing within that swing and there be happy.

Sanskit Text: वसिष्ठं ह वरुणो नाव्याधाद रषिं चकार सवपा महोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasiṣṭhaṃ ha varuṇo nāvyādhād ṛṣiṃ cakāra svapā mahobhiḥ |
Translation: 4 Varuṇa placed Vasiṣṭha in the vessel, and deftly with his niight made him a Ṛṣi.

Sanskit Text: सतोतारं विप्रः सुदिनत्वे अह्नां यान नु दयावस्ततनन यादुषासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stotāraṃ vipraḥ sudinatve ahnāṃ yān nu dyāvastatanan yāduṣāsaḥ ||
Translation: When days shone bright the Sage made him a singer, while the heavens broadened and the Dawns were lengthened.

Sanskit Text: कव तयानि नौ सख्या बभूवुः सचावहे यदव्र्कं पुरा चित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kva tyāni nau sakhyā babhūvuḥ sacāvahe yadavṛkaṃ purā cit |
Translation: 5 What hath become of those our ancient friendships, when without enmity we walked together?

Sanskit Text: बर्हन्तं मानं वरुण सवधावः सहस्रद्वारं जगमा गर्हं ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhantaṃ mānaṃ varuṇa svadhāvaḥ sahasradvāraṃ jaghamā ghṛhaṃ te ||
Translation: I, Varuṇa, thou glorious Lord, have entered thy lofty home, thine house with thousand portals.

Sanskit Text: य आपिर्नित्यो वरुण परियः सन तवामागांसि कर्णवत सखा ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya āpirnityo varuṇa priyaḥ san tvāmāghāṃsi kṛṇavat sakhā te |
Translation: 6 If he, thy true ally, hath sinned against thee, still, Varuṇa, he is the friend thou lovedst.

Sanskit Text: मा त एनस्वन्तो यक्षिन भुजेम यन्धि षमा विप्र सतुवते वरूथम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā ta enasvanto yakṣin bhujema yandhi ṣmā vipra stuvate varūtham ||
Translation: Let us not, Living One, as sinners I know thee: give shelter, as a Sage, to him who lauds thee.

Sanskit Text: धरुवासु तवासु कषितिषु कषियन्तो वयस्मत पाशं वरुणोमुमोचत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhruvāsu tvāsu kṣitiṣu kṣiyanto vyasmat pāśaṃ varuṇomumocat |
Translation: 7 While we abide in these fixed habitations, and from the lap of Aditi win favour,

Sanskit Text: अवो वन्वाना अदितेरुपस्थाद यूयं पात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avo vanvānā aditerupasthād yūyaṃ pāta ||
Translation: May Varuṇa untie the bond that binds us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: मो षु वरुण मर्न्मयं गर्हं राजन्नहं गमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mo ṣu varuṇa mṛnmayaṃ ghṛhaṃ rājannahaṃ ghamam |
Translation: 1. LET me not yet, King Varuṇa, enter into the house of clay:

Sanskit Text: मर्ळा सुक्षत्र मर्ळय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mṛḷā sukṣatra mṛḷaya ||
Translation: Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.

Sanskit Text: यदेमि परस्फुरन्निव दर्तिर्न धमातो अद्रिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yademi prasphuranniva dṛtirna dhmāto adrivaḥ |
Translation: 2 When, Thunderer! I move along tremulous like a wind-blown skin,

Sanskit Text: मर्ळा स. म. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mṛḷā s. m. ||
Translation: Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.

Sanskit Text: करत्वः समह दीनता परतीपं जगमा शुचे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratvaḥ samaha dīnatā pratīpaṃ jaghamā śuce |
Translation: 3 O Bright and Powerful God, through want of strength I erred and went astray

Sanskit Text: मर्ळा स. म. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mṛḷā s. m. ||
Translation: Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.

Sanskit Text: अपां मध्ये तस्थिवांसं तर्ष्णाविदज्जरितारम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāṃ madhye tasthivāṃsaṃ tṛṣṇāvidajjaritāram |
Translation: 4 Thirst found thy worshipper though he stood in the midst of water-fijods:

Sanskit Text: मर्ळा स. म. ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mṛḷā s. m. ||
Translation: Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.

Sanskit Text: यत किं चेदं वरुण दैव्ये जने.अभिद्रोहं मनुष्याश्चरामसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat kiṃ cedaṃ varuṇa daivye jane.abhidrohaṃ manuṣyāścarāmasi |
Translation: 5 O Varuṇa, whatever the offence may be which we as men commit against the heavenly host,

Sanskit Text: अचित्ती यत तव धर्मा युयोपिम मा नस्तस्मादेनसो देव रीरिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: acittī yat tava dharmā yuyopima mā nastasmādenaso deva rīriṣaḥ ||
Translation: When through our want of thought we violate thy laws, punish us not, O God, for that iniquity.

Sanskit Text: पर वीरया शुचयो दद्रिरे वामध्वर्युभिर्मधुमन्तः सुतासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vīrayā śucayo dadrire vāmadhvaryubhirmadhumantaḥ sutāsaḥ |
Translation: 1. To you pure juice, rich in meath, are offered by priest: through longing for the Pair of Heroes.

Sanskit Text: वह वायो नियुतो याह्यछा पिबा सुतस्यान्धसो मदाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaha vāyo niyuto yāhyachā pibā sutasyāndhaso madāya ||
Translation: Drive, Vāyu, bring thine harnessed horses hither: drink the pressed Soma till it make thee joyful.

Sanskit Text: ईशानाय परहुतिं यस्त आनट छुचिं सोमं शुचिपास्तुभ्यं वायो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īśānāya prahutiṃ yasta ānaṭ chuciṃ somaṃ śucipāstubhyaṃ vāyo |
Translation: 2 Whoso to thee, the Mighty, brings oblation, pure Soma unto thee, pure-drinking Vāyu,

Sanskit Text: कर्णोषि तं मर्त्येषु परशस्तं जातो-जातो जायते वाज्यस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṇoṣi taṃ martyeṣu praśastaṃ jāto-jāto jāyate vājyasya ||
Translation: That man thou makest famous among mortals: to him strong sons are born in quick succession.

Sanskit Text: राये नु यं जज्ञतू रोदसीमे राये देवी धिषणा धाति देवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāye nu yaṃ jajñatū rodasīme rāye devī dhiṣaṇā dhāti devam |
Translation: 3 The God whom both these worlds brought forth for riches, whom heavenly Dhiṣaṇā for our wealth appointeth,

Sanskit Text: अध वायुं नियुतः सश्चत सवा उत शवेतं वसुधितिं निरेके ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha vāyuṃ niyutaḥ saścata svā uta śvetaṃ vasudhitiṃ nireke ||
Translation: His team of harnessed horses waits on Vāyu, and, foremost, on the radiant Treasure-bearer.

Sanskit Text: उछन्नुषसः सुदिना अरिप्रा उरु जयोतिर्विविदुर्दीध्यानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uchannuṣasaḥ sudinā ariprā uru jyotirvividurdīdhyānāḥ |
Translation: 4 The spotless Dawns with fair bright days have broken; they found the spacious light when they were shining.

Sanskit Text: गव्यं चिदूर्वमुशिजो वि वव्रुस्तेषामनु परदिवः सस्रुरापः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghavyaṃ cidūrvamuśijo vi vavrusteṣāmanu pradivaḥ sasrurāpaḥ ||
Translation: Eagerly they disclosed the stall of cattle: floods streamed for them as in the days aforetime.

Sanskit Text: ते सत्येन मनसा दीध्यानाः सवेन युक्तासः करतुना वहन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te satyena manasā dīdhyānāḥ svena yuktāsaḥ kratunā vahanti |
Translation: 5 These with their truthful spirit, shining brightly, move on provided with their natural insight.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रवायू वीरवाहं रथं वामीशानयोरभि पर्क्षः सचन्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indravāyū vīravāhaṃ rathaṃ vāmīśānayorabhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante ||
Translation: Viands attend the car that beareth Heroes, your car, ye Sovran Pair, Indra and Vāyu.

Sanskit Text: ईशानासो ये दधते सवर्णो गोभिरश्वेभिर्वसुभिर्हिरण्यैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īśānāso ye dadhate svarṇo ghobhiraśvebhirvasubhirhiraṇyaiḥ |
Translation: 6 May these who give us heavenly light, these rulers, with gifts of kine and horses, gold and treasures.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रवायू सूरयो विश्वमायुरर्वद्भिर्वीरैः पर्तनासु सह्युः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indravāyū sūrayo viśvamāyurarvadbhirvīraiḥ pṛtanāsu sahyuḥ ||
Translation: These princes, through full life, Indra and Vāyu! o’ercome in battle with their steeds and heroes.

Sanskit Text: अर्वन्तो न शरवसो भिक्षमाणा इन्द्रवायू सुष्टुतिभिर्वसिष्ठाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvanto na śravaso bhikṣamāṇā indravāyū suṣṭutibhirvasiṣṭhāḥ |
Translation: 7 Like coursers seeking fame will we Vasisthas, O Indra-Vāyu, with our fair laudations.

Sanskit Text: वाजयन्तः सववसे हुवेम यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājayantaḥ svavase huvema yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Exerting all our power call you to aid us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: आ वायो भूष शुचिपा उप नः सहस्रं ते नियुतो विश्ववार |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāyo bhūṣa śucipā upa naḥ sahasraṃ te niyuto viśvavāra |
Translation: 1. O VĀYU, drinker of the pure, be near us: a thousand teams are thine, Allbounteous Giver.

Sanskit Text: उपो ते अन्धो मद्यमयामि यस्य देव दधिषे पूर्वपेयम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upo te andho madyamayāmi yasya deva dadhiṣe pūrvapeyam ||
Translation: To thee the rapture-bringing juice is offered, whose first draught, God, thou takest as thy portion.

Sanskit Text: पर सोता जीरो अध्वरेष्वस्थात सोममिन्द्राय वायवे पिबध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sotā jīro adhvareṣvasthāt somamindrāya vāyave pibadhyai |
Translation: 2 Prompt at the holy rites forth came the presser with Soma-draughts for Indra and for Vāyu,

Sanskit Text: पर यद वां मध्वो अग्रियं भरन्त्यध्वर्यवो देवयन्तः शचीभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yad vāṃ madhvo aghriyaṃ bharantyadhvaryavo devayantaḥ śacībhiḥ ||
Translation: When ministering priests with strong devotion bring to you Twain the first taste of the Soma.

Sanskit Text: पर याभिर्यासि दाश्वांसमछा नियुद्भिर्वायविष्टयेदुरोणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yābhiryāsi dāśvāṃsamachā niyudbhirvāyaviṣṭayeduroṇe |
Translation: 3 The teams wherewith thou seekest him who offers, within his home, O Viyu, to direct him,

Sanskit Text: नि नो रयिं सुभोजसं युवस्व नि वीरं गव्यमश्व्यं च राधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni no rayiṃ subhojasaṃ yuvasva ni vīraṃ ghavyamaśvyaṃ ca rādhaḥ ||
Translation: Therewith send wealth: to us with full enjoyment, a hero son and gifts of kine and horses.

Sanskit Text: ये वायव इन्द्रमादनास आदेवासो नितोशनासो अर्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye vāyava indramādanāsa ādevāso nitośanāso aryaḥ |
Translation: 4 Near to the Gods and making Indra joyful, devout and ofFering precious gifts to Vāyu,

Sanskit Text: घनन्तो वर्त्राणि सूरिभिः षयाम सासह्वांसो युधा नर्भिरमित्रान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghnanto vṛtrāṇi sūribhiḥ ṣyāma sāsahvāṃso yudhā nṛbhiramitrān ||
Translation: Allied with princes, smiting down the hostile, may we with heroes conquer foes in battle.

Sanskit Text: आ नो नियुद्भिः शतिनीभिरध्वरं सहस्रिणीभिरुप याहि यज्ञम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no niyudbhiḥ śatinībhiradhvaraṃ sahasriṇībhirupa yāhi yajñam |
Translation: 5 With thy yoked teams in hundreds and in thousands come to our sacrifice and solemn worship.

Sanskit Text: वायो अस्मिन सवने मादयस्व यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāyo asmin savane mādayasva yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Come, Vāyu, make thee glad at this libation. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: शुचिं नु सतोमं नवजातमद्येन्द्राग्नी वर्त्रहणा जुषेथाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuciṃ nu stomaṃ navajātamadyendrāghnī vṛtrahaṇā juṣethām |
Translation: 1. SLAYERS of enemies, Indra and Agni, accept this day our new-born pure laudation.

Sanskit Text: उभा हि वां सुहवा जोहवीमि ता वाजं सद्य उशतेधेष्ठा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhā hi vāṃ suhavā johavīmi tā vājaṃ sadya uśatedheṣṭhā ||
Translation: Again, again I call you prompt to listen, best to give quickly strength to him who craves it.

Sanskit Text: ता सानसी शवसाना हि भूतं साकंव्र्धा शवसा शूशुवांसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā sānasī śavasānā hi bhūtaṃ sākaṃvṛdhā śavasā śūśuvāṃsā |
Translation: 2 For ye were strong to gain, exceeding mighty, growing together, waxing in your vigour.

Sanskit Text: कषयन्तौ रायो यवसस्य भूरेः पर्ङकतं वाजस्य सथविरस्य घर्ष्वेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣayantau rāyo yavasasya bhūreḥ pṛṅktaṃ vājasya sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ ||
Translation: Lords of the pasture filled with ample riches, bestow upon us strength both fresh and lasting.

Sanskit Text: उपो ह यद विदथं वाजिनो गुर्धीभिर्विप्राः परमतिमिछमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upo ha yad vidathaṃ vājino ghurdhībhirviprāḥ pramatimichamānāḥ |
Translation: 3 Yea when the strong have entered our assembly, and singers seeking with their hymns your favour,

Sanskit Text: अर्वन्तो न काष्ठां नक्षमाणा इन्द्राग्नी जोहुवतो नरस्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvanto na kāṣṭhāṃ nakṣamāṇā indrāghnī johuvato naraste ||
Translation: They are like steeds who come into the race-course, those men who call aloud on Indra-Agni.

Sanskit Text: गीर्भिर्विप्रः परमतिमिछमान ईट्टे रयिं यशसं पूर्वभाजम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghīrbhirvipraḥ pramatimichamāna īṭṭe rayiṃ yaśasaṃ pūrvabhājam |
Translation: 4 The singer, seeking with his hymns your favour, begs splendid riches of their first possessor.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी वर्त्रहणा सुवज्रा पर नो नव्येभिस्तिरतं देष्णैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī vṛtrahaṇā suvajrā pra no navyebhistirataṃ deṣṇaiḥ ||
Translation: Further us with new bounties, Indra-Agni, armed with strong thunder, slayers of the foeman.

Sanskit Text: सं यन मही मिथती सपर्धमाने तनूरुचा शूरसाता यतैते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yan mahī mithatī spardhamāne tanūrucā śūrasātā yataite |
Translation: 5 When two great hosts, arrayed against each other, meet clothed with brightness, in the fierce encounter

Sanskit Text: अदेवयुं विदथे देवयुभिः सत्रा हतं सोमसुता जनेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adevayuṃ vidathe devayubhiḥ satrā hataṃ somasutā janena ||
Translation: Stand ye beside the godly, smite the godless; and still assist the men who press the Soma.

Sanskit Text: इमामु षु सोमसुतिमुप न एन्द्राग्नी सौमनसाय यातम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imāmu ṣu somasutimupa na endrāghnī saumanasāya yātam |
Translation: 6 To this our Soma-pressing, Indra-Agni, come ye prepared to show your loving-kindness,

Sanskit Text: नू चिद धि परिमम्नाथे अस्माना वां शश्वद्भिर्वव्र्तीय वाजैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū cid dhi parimamnāthe asmānā vāṃ śaśvadbhirvavṛtīya vājaiḥ ||
Translation: For not at any time have ye despised us. So may I draw you with all strengthenings hither.

Sanskit Text: सो अग्न एना नमसा समिद्धो.अछा मित्रं वरुणमिन्द्रं वोचेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: so aghna enā namasā samiddho.achā mitraṃ varuṇamindraṃ voceḥ |
Translation: 7 So Agni, kindled mid this adoration, invite thou Mitra, Varuṇa, and Indra.

Sanskit Text: यत सीमागश्चक्र्मा तत सु मर्ळ तदर्यमादितिःशिश्रथन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat sīmāghaścakṛmā tat su mṛḷa tadaryamāditiḥśiśrathantu ||
Translation: Forgive whatever sin we have committed may Aryaman and Aditi remove it.

Sanskit Text: एता अग्न आशुषाणास इष्टीर्युवोः सचाभ्यश्याम वाजान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etā aghna āśuṣāṇāsa iṣṭīryuvoḥ sacābhyaśyāma vājān |
Translation: 8 While we accelerate these our sacrifices, may we win strength from both of you, O Agni:

Sanskit Text: मेन्द्रो नो विष्णुर्मरुतः परि खयन यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mendro no viṣṇurmarutaḥ pari khyan yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Ne’er may the Maruts, Indra, Viṣṇu slight us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: इयं वामस्य मन्मन इन्द्राग्नी पूर्व्यस्तुतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyaṃ vāmasya manmana indrāghnī pūrvyastutiḥ |
Translation: 1. As rain from out the cloud, for you, Indra and Agni, from my soul

Sanskit Text: अभ्राद वर्ष्टिरिवाजनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhrād vṛṣṭirivājani ||
Translation: This noblest praise hath been produced.

Sanskit Text: शर्णुतं जरितुर्हवमिन्द्राग्नी वनतं गिरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇutaṃ jariturhavamindrāghnī vanataṃ ghiraḥ |
Translation: 2 Do ye, O Indra-Agni, hear the singer's call: accept his songs.

Sanskit Text: ईशानापिप्यतं धियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: īśānāpipyataṃ dhiyaḥ ||
Translation: Ye Rulers, grant his heart's desire.

Sanskit Text: मा पापत्वाय नो नरेन्द्राग्नी माभिशस्तये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā pāpatvāya no narendrāghnī mābhiśastaye |
Translation: 3 Give us not up to poverty, ye Heroes, Indra-Agni, nor

Sanskit Text: मा नो रीरधतं निदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no rīradhataṃ nide ||
Translation: To slander and reproach of men.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रे अग्ना नमो बर्हत सुव्र्क्तिमेरयामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indre aghnā namo bṛhat suvṛktimerayāmahe |
Translation: 4 To Indra and to Agni we bring reverence, high and holy hymn,

Sanskit Text: धिया धेना अवस्यवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiyā dhenā avasyavaḥ ||
Translation: And, craving help, softwords with prayer.

Sanskit Text: ता हि शश्वन्त ईळत इत्था विप्रास ऊतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā hi śaśvanta īḷata itthā viprāsa ūtaye |
Translation: 5 For all these holy singers here implore these Twain to succour them,

Sanskit Text: सबाधो वाजसातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sabādho vājasātaye ||
Translation: And priests that they may win them strength.

Sanskit Text: ता वां गीर्भिर्विपन्यवः परयस्वन्तो हवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā vāṃ ghīrbhirvipanyavaḥ prayasvanto havāmahe |
Translation: 6 Eager to laudyou, we with songs invoke you, bearing sacred food,

Sanskit Text: मेधसाता सनिष्यवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: medhasātā saniṣyavaḥ ||
Translation: Fain for success in sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी अवसा गतमस्मभ्यं चर्षणीसहा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī avasā ghatamasmabhyaṃ carṣaṇīsahā |
Translation: 7 Indra and Agni, come to us with favour, ye who conquer men:

Sanskit Text: मा नो दुःशंस ईशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no duḥśaṃsa īśata ||
Translation: Let not the wicked master us.

Sanskit Text: मा कस्य नो अररुषो धूर्तिः परणं मर्त्यस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā kasya no araruṣo dhūrtiḥ praṇaṃ martyasya |
Translation: 8 At no time let the injurious blow of hostile mortal fall on us:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नीशर्म यछतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnīśarma yachatam ||
Translation: O Indra-Agni, shelter us.

Sanskit Text: गोमद धिरण्यवद वसु यद वामश्वावदीमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghomad dhiraṇyavad vasu yad vāmaśvāvadīmahe |
Translation: 9 Whatever wealth we crave of you, in gold, in cattle, or in steeds,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नीतद वनेमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnītad vanemahi ||
Translation: That, Indra-Agni, let us gain;

Sanskit Text: यत सोम आ सुते नर इन्द्राग्नी अजोहवुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat soma ā sute nara indrāghnī ajohavuḥ |
Translation: 10 When heroes prompt in worship call Indra and Agni, Lords of steeds,

Sanskit Text: सप्तीवन्ता सपर्यवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saptīvantā saparyavaḥ ||
Translation: Beside the Soma juice effused.

Sanskit Text: उक्थेभिर्व्र्त्रहन्तमा या मन्दाना चिदा गिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukthebhirvṛtrahantamā yā mandānā cidā ghirā |
Translation: 11 Call hither with the song and lauds those who best slay the foemen, those

Sanskit Text: आङगूषैराविवासतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āṅghūṣairāvivāsataḥ ||
Translation: Who take delight in hymns of praise.

Sanskit Text: ताविद दुःशंसं मर्त्यं दुर्विद्वांसं रक्षस्विनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāvid duḥśaṃsaṃ martyaṃ durvidvāṃsaṃ rakṣasvinam |
Translation: 12 Slay ye the wicked man whose thought is evil of the demon kind.

Sanskit Text: आभोगं हन्मना हतमुदधिं हन्मना हतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ābhoghaṃ hanmanā hatamudadhiṃ hanmanā hatam ||
Translation: Slay him who stays the waters, slay the Serpent with your deadly dart.

Sanskit Text: पर कषोदसा धायसा सस्र एषा सरस्वती धरुणमायसी पूः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra kṣodasā dhāyasā sasra eṣā sarasvatī dharuṇamāyasī pūḥ |
Translation: 1. THIS stream Sarasvatī with fostering current comes forth, our sure defence, our fort of iron.

Sanskit Text: परबाबधाना रथ्येव याति विश्वा अपो महिना सिन्धुरन्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prabābadhānā rathyeva yāti viśvā apo mahinā sindhuranyāḥ ||
Translation: As on a car, the flood flows on, surpassing in majesty and might all other waters.

Sanskit Text: एकाचेतत सरस्वती नदीनां शुचिर्यती गिरिभ्य आ समुद्रात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ekācetat sarasvatī nadīnāṃ śuciryatī ghiribhya ā samudrāt |
Translation: 2 Pure in her course from mountains to the ocean, alone of streams Sarasvatī hath listened.

Sanskit Text: रायश्चेतन्ती भुवनस्य भूरेर्घ्र्तं पयो दुदुहे नाहुषाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyaścetantī bhuvanasya bhūrerghṛtaṃ payo duduhe nāhuṣāya ||
Translation: Thinking of wealth and the great world of creatures, she poured for Nahuṣa her milk and fatness.

Sanskit Text: स वाव्र्धे नर्यो योषणासु वर्षा शिशुर्व्र्षभो यज्ञियासु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vāvṛdhe naryo yoṣaṇāsu vṛṣā śiśurvṛṣabho yajñiyāsu |
Translation: 3 Friendly to man he grew among the women, a strong young Steer amid the Holy Ladies.

Sanskit Text: स वाजिनं मघवद्भ्यो दधाति वि सातये तन्वं माम्र्जीत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vājinaṃ maghavadbhyo dadhāti vi sātaye tanvaṃ māmṛjīta ||
Translation: He gives the fleet steed to our wealthy princes, and decks their bodies for success in battle.

Sanskit Text: उत सया नः सरस्वती जुषाणोप शरवत सुभगा यज्णे अस्मिन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta syā naḥ sarasvatī juṣāṇopa śravat subhaghā yajṇe asmin |
Translation: 4 May this Sarasvatī be pleased and listen at this our sacrifice, auspicious Lady,

Sanskit Text: मितज्ञुभिर्नमस्यैरियाना राया युजा चिदुत्तरा सखिभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitajñubhirnamasyairiyānā rāyā yujā ciduttarā sakhibhyaḥ ||
Translation: When we with reverence, on our knees, implore her close-knit to wealth, most kind to those she loveth.

Sanskit Text: इमा जुह्वाना युष्मदा नमोभिः परति सतोमं सरस्वति जुषस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā juhvānā yuṣmadā namobhiḥ prati stomaṃ sarasvati juṣasva |
Translation: 5 These offerings have ye made with adoration: say this, Sarasvatī, and accept our praises;

Sanskit Text: तव शर्मन परियतमे दधाना उप सथेयाम शरणं न वर्क्षम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava śarman priyatame dadhānā upa stheyāma śaraṇaṃ na vṛkṣam ||
Translation: And, placing us under thy dear protection, may we approach thee, as a tree, for shelter.

Sanskit Text: अयमु ते सरस्वति वसिष्ठो दवाराव रतस्य सुभगे वयावः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayamu te sarasvati vasiṣṭho dvārāv ṛtasya subhaghe vyāvaḥ |
Translation: 6 For thee, O Blest Sarasvatī, Vasiṣṭha hath here unbarred the doors d sacred Order.

Sanskit Text: वर्ध शुभ्रे सतुवते रासि वाजान यूयं पात ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vardha śubhre stuvate rāsi vājān yūyaṃ pāta ... ||
Translation: Wax, Bright One, and give strength to him who lauds thee. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: बर्हदु गायिषे वचो.असुर्या नदीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhadu ghāyiṣe vaco.asuryā nadīnām |
Translation: 1. I SING a lofty song, for she is mightiest, most divine of Streams.

Sanskit Text: सरस्वतीमिन महयासुव्र्क्तिभिः सतोमैर्वसिष्ठ रोदसी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarasvatīmin mahayāsuvṛktibhiḥ stomairvasiṣṭha rodasī ||
Translation: Sarasvatī will I exalt with hymns and lauds, and, O Vasiṣṭha, Heaven and Earth.

Sanskit Text: उभे यत ते महिना शुभ्रे अन्धसी अधिक्षियन्ति पूरवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhe yat te mahinā śubhre andhasī adhikṣiyanti pūravaḥ |
Translation: 2 When in the fulness of their strength the Pūrus dwell, Beauteous One, on thy two grassy banks,

Sanskit Text: सा नो बोध्यवित्री मरुत्सखा चोद राधो मघोनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā no bodhyavitrī marutsakhā coda rādho maghonām ||
Translation: Favour us thou who hast the Maruts for thy friends: stir up the bounty of our chiefs.

Sanskit Text: भद्रमिद भद्रा कर्णवत सरस्वत्यकवारी चेतति वाजिनीवती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadramid bhadrā kṛṇavat sarasvatyakavārī cetati vājinīvatī |
Translation: 3 So may Sarasvatī auspicious send good luck; she, rich in spoil, is never niggardly in thought,

Sanskit Text: गर्णाना जमदग्निवत सतुवाना च वसिष्ठवत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛṇānā jamadaghnivat stuvānā ca vasiṣṭhavat ||
Translation: When praised in jamadagni's way and lauded as Vasiṣṭha lauds.

Sanskit Text: जनीयन्तो नवग्रवः पुत्रीयन्तः सुदानवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: janīyanto nvaghravaḥ putrīyantaḥ sudānavaḥ |
Translation: 4 We call upon Sarasvān, as unmarried men who long for wives,

Sanskit Text: सरस्वन्तं हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarasvantaṃ havāmahe ||
Translation: As liberal men who yearn for sons.

Sanskit Text: ये ते सरस्व ऊर्मयो मधुमन्तो घर्तश्चुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye te sarasva ūrmayo madhumanto ghṛtaścutaḥ |
Translation: 5 Be thou our kind protector, O Sarasvān, with those waves of thine

Sanskit Text: तेभिर्नो.अविता भव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tebhirno.avitā bhava ||
Translation: Laden with sweets and dropping oil.

Sanskit Text: पीपिवांसं सरस्वत सतनं यो विश्वदर्षतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pīpivāṃsaṃ sarasvata stanaṃ yo viśvadarṣataḥ |
Translation: 6 May we enjoy Sarasvān's breast, all-beautiful, that swells with streams,

Sanskit Text: भक्षीमहि परजामिषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhakṣīmahi prajāmiṣam ||
Translation: May we gain food and progeny.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञे दिवो नर्षदने पर्थिव्या नरो यत्र देवयवो मदन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñe divo nṛṣadane pṛthivyā naro yatra devayavo madanti |
Translation: 1. WHERE Heaven and Earth combine in men's assembly, and ttose who love the Gods delight in worship,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय यत्र सवनानि सुन्वे गमन मदाय परथमं वयश च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya yatra savanāni sunve ghaman madāya prathamaṃ vayaś ca ||
Translation: Where the libations are effused for Indra, may he come first to drink and make him stronger.

Sanskit Text: आ दैव्या वर्णीमहे ऽवांसि बर्हस्पतिर नो मह आ सखायः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā daivyā vṛṇīmahe 'vāṃsi bṛhaspatir no maha ā sakhāyaḥ |
Translation: 2 We crave the heavenly grace of Gods to guard us-so may Bṛhaspati, O friends, exalt us-

Sanskit Text: यथा भवेम मीळ्हुषे अनागा यो नो दाता परावतः पितेव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā bhavema mīḷhuṣe anāghā yo no dātā parāvataḥ piteva ||
Translation: That he, the Bounteous God, may find us sintess, who giveth from a distance like a father.

Sanskit Text: तम उ जयेष्ठं नमसा हविर्भिः सुशेवम बरह्मणस पतिं गर्णीषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tam u jyeṣṭhaṃ namasā havirbhiḥ suśevam brahmaṇas patiṃ ghṛṇīṣe |
Translation: 3 That Brahmaṇaspati, most High and Gracious, I glorify with offerings and with homage.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं शलोको महि दैव्यः सिषक्तु यो बरह्मणो देवक्र्तस्य राजा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ śloko mahi daivyaḥ siṣaktu yo brahmaṇo devakṛtasya rājā ||
Translation: May the great song of praise divine, reach Indra who is the King of prayer the Gods’ creation.

Sanskit Text: स आ नो योनिं सदतु परेष्ठो बर्हस्पतिर विश्ववारो यो अस्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ā no yoniṃ sadatu preṣṭho bṛhaspatir viśvavāro yo asti |
Translation: 4 May that Bṛhaspati who brings all blessings, most dearly loved, be seated by our altar.

Sanskit Text: कामो रायः सुवीर्यस्य तं दात पर्षन नो अति सश्चतो अरिष्टान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kāmo rāyaḥ suvīryasya taṃ dāt parṣan no ati saścato ariṣṭān ||
Translation: Heroes and wealth we crave; may he bestow them, and bear us safe beyond the men who vex us.

Sanskit Text: तम आ नो अर्कम अम्र्ताय जुष्टम इमे धासुर अम्र्तासः पुराजाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tam ā no arkam amṛtāya juṣṭam ime dhāsur amṛtāsaḥ purājāḥ |
Translation: 5 To us these Deathless Ones, erst born, have granted this laud of ours which gives the Immortal pleasure.

Sanskit Text: शुचिक्रन्दं यजतम पस्त्य्र्नाम बर्हस्पतिम अनर्वाणं हुवेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śucikrandaṃ yajatam pastyṛnām bṛhaspatim anarvāṇaṃ huvema ||
Translation: Let us invoke Bṛhaspati, the foeless, the clear-voiced God, the Holy One of households

Sanskit Text: तं शग्मासो अरुषासो अश्वा बर्हस्पतिं सहवाहो वहन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ śaghmāso aruṣāso aśvā bṛhaspatiṃ sahavāho vahanti |
Translation: 6 Him, this Bṛhaspati, his red-hued horses, drawing together, full of strength, bring hither.

Sanskit Text: सहश चिद यस्य नीलवत सधस्थं नभो न रूपम अरुषं वसानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahaś cid yasya nīlavat sadhasthaṃ nabho na rūpam aruṣaṃ vasānāḥ ||
Translation: Robed in red colour like the cloud, they carry the Lord of Might whose friendship gives a dwelling.

Sanskit Text: स हि शुचिः शतपत्रः स शुन्ध्युर हिरण्यवाशीर इषिरः सवर्षाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi śuciḥ śatapatraḥ sa śundhyur hiraṇyavāśīr iṣiraḥ svarṣāḥ |
Translation: 7 For he is pure, with hundred wings, refulgent, with sword of gold, impetuous, winning sunlight.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिः स सवावेश रष्वः पुरू सखिभ्य आसुतिं करिष्ठः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiḥ sa svāveśa ṛṣvaḥ purū sakhibhya āsutiṃ kariṣṭhaḥ ||
Translation: Sublime Bṛhaspati, easy of access granteth his friends most bountiful refreshment.

Sanskit Text: देवी देवस्य रोदसी जनित्री बर्हस्पतिं वाव्र्धतुर महित्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devī devasya rodasī janitrī bṛhaspatiṃ vāvṛdhatur mahitvā |
Translation: 8 Both Heaven and Earth, divine, the Deity's Parents, have made Bṛhaspati increase in grandeur.

Sanskit Text: दक्षाय्याय दक्षता सखायः करद बरह्मणे सुतरा सुगाधा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dakṣāyyāya dakṣatā sakhāyaḥ karad brahmaṇe sutarā sughādhā ||
Translation: Glorify him, O friends, who merits glory: may he give prayer fair way and easy passage.

Sanskit Text: इयं वाम बरह्मणस पते सुव्र्क्तिर बरह्मेन्द्राय वज्रिणे अकारि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyaṃ vām brahmaṇas pate suvṛktir brahmendrāya vajriṇe akāri |
Translation: 9 This, Brahmaṇaspati, is your laudation prayer hath been made to thunderwielding Indra.

Sanskit Text: अविष्टं धियो जिग्र्तम पुरंधीर जजस्तम अर्यो वनुषाम अरातीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aviṣṭaṃ dhiyo jighṛtam puraṃdhīr jajastam aryo vanuṣām arātīḥ ||
Translation: Favour our songs, wake up our thought and spirit: destroy the godless and our foemen's malice.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पते युवम इन्द्रश च वस्वो दिव्यस्येशाथे उत पार्थिवस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspate yuvam indraś ca vasvo divyasyeśāthe uta pārthivasya |
Translation: 10 Ye Twain are Lords of wealth in earth and heaven, thou, O Bṛhaspati, and thou, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: धत्तं रयिं सतुवते कीरये चिद यूयम पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhattaṃ rayiṃ stuvate kīraye cid yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ ||
Translation: Mean though he be, give wealth to him who lauds you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: अध्वर्यवो ऽरुणं दुग्धम अंशुं जुहोतन वर्षभाय कषितीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhvaryavo 'ruṇaṃ dughdham aṃśuṃ juhotana vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām |
Translation: 1. PRIESTS, offer to the Lord of all the people the milked-out stalk of Soma, radiant-coloured.

Sanskit Text: गौराद वेदीयां अवपानम इन्द्रो विश्वाहेद याति सुतसोमम इछन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghaurād vedīyāṃ avapānam indro viśvāhed yāti sutasomam ichan ||
Translation: No wild-bull knows his drinking-place like Indra who ever seeks him who hath pressed the Soma,

Sanskit Text: यद दधिषे परदिवि चार्व अन्नं दिवे-दिवे पीतिम इद अस्य वक्षि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad dadhiṣe pradivi cārv annaṃ dive-dive pītim id asya vakṣi |
Translation: 2 Thou dost desire to drink, each day that passes, the pleasant food which thou hast had aforetime,

Sanskit Text: उत हर्दोत मनसा जुषाण उशन्न इन्द्र परस्थितान पाहि सोमान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta hṛdota manasā juṣāṇa uśann indra prasthitān pāhi somān ||
Translation: O Indra, gratified in heart and spirit, drink eagerly the Soma set before thee.

Sanskit Text: जज्ञानः सोमं सहसे पपाथ पर ते माता महिमानम उवाच |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jajñānaḥ somaṃ sahase papātha pra te mātā mahimānam uvāca |
Translation: 3 Thou, newly-born, for strength didst drink the Soma; the Mother told thee of thy future greatness.

Sanskit Text: एन्द्र पप्राथोर्व अन्तरिक्षं युधा देवेभ्यो वरिवश चकर्थ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: endra paprāthorv antarikṣaṃ yudhā devebhyo varivaś cakartha ||
Translation: O Indra, thou hast filled mid-air's wide region, and given the Gods by battle room and freedom.

Sanskit Text: यद योधया महतो मन्यमानान साक्षाम तान बाहुभिः शाशदानान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad yodhayā mahato manyamānān sākṣāma tān bāhubhiḥ śāśadānān |
Translation: 4 When thou hast urged the arrocrant to combat, proud in their strength of arm, we will subdue them.

Sanskit Text: यद वा नर्भिर वर्त इन्द्राभियुध्यास तं तवयाजिं सौश्रवसं जयेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā nṛbhir vṛta indrābhiyudhyās taṃ tvayājiṃ sauśravasaṃ jayema ||
Translation: Or, Indra, when thou fightest girt by heroes, we in the glorious fray with thee will conquer.

Sanskit Text: परेन्द्रस्य वोचम परथमा कर्तानि पर नूतना मघवा या चकार |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prendrasya vocam prathamā kṛtāni pra nūtanā maghavā yā cakāra |
Translation: 5 I will declare the earliest deeds of Indra, and recent acts which Maghavan hath accomplished.

Sanskit Text: यदेद अदेवीर असहिष्ट माया अथाभवत केवलः सोमो अस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaded adevīr asahiṣṭa māyā athābhavat kevalaḥ somo asya ||
Translation: When he had conquered godless wiles and magic, Soma became his own entire possession.

Sanskit Text: तवेदं विश्वम अभितः पशव्यं यत पश्यसि चक्षसा सूर्यस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tavedaṃ viśvam abhitaḥ paśavyaṃ yat paśyasi cakṣasā sūryasya |
Translation: 6 Thine is this world of flocks and herds around thee, which with the eye of Sūrya thou beholdest.

Sanskit Text: गवाम असि गोपतिर एक इन्द्र भक्षीमहि ते परयतस्य वस्वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghavām asi ghopatir eka indra bhakṣīmahi te prayatasya vasvaḥ ||
Translation: Thou, Indra, art alone the Lord of cattle; may we enjoy the treasure which thou givest.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पते युवम इन्द्रश च वस्वो दिव्यस्येशाथे उत पार्थिवस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspate yuvam indraś ca vasvo divyasyeśāthe uta pārthivasya |
Translation: 7 Ye Twain are Lords of wealth in earth and heaven, thou, O Bṛhaspati, and thou, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: धत्तं रयिं सतुवते कीरये चिद यूयम पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhattaṃ rayiṃ stuvate kīraye cid yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ ||
Translation: Mean though he be, give wealth to him who lauds you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: परो मात्रया तन्व्र वर्धान न ते महित्वम अन्व अश्नुवन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: paro mātrayā tanvṛ vṛdhāna na te mahitvam anv aśnuvanti |
Translation: 1. MEN come not nigh thy majesty who growest beyond all bound and measure with thy body.

Sanskit Text: उभे ते विद्म रजसी पर्थिव्या विष्णो देव तवम परमस्य वित्से ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhe te vidma rajasī pṛthivyā viṣṇo deva tvam paramasya vitse ||
Translation: Both thy two regions of the earth, O Viṣṇu, we know: thou God, knowest the highest also.

Sanskit Text: न ते विष्णो जायमानो न जातो देव महिम्नः परम अन्तम आप |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na te viṣṇo jāyamāno na jāto deva mahimnaḥ param antam āpa |
Translation: 2 None who is born or being born, God Viṣṇu, hath reached the utmost limit of thy grandeur.

Sanskit Text: उद अस्तभ्ना नाकम रष्वम बर्हन्तं दाधर्थ पराचीं ककुभम पर्थिव्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud astabhnā nākam ṛṣvam bṛhantaṃ dādhartha prācīṃ kakubham pṛthivyāḥ ||
Translation: The vast high vault of heaven hast thou supported, and fixed earth's eastern pinnacle securely.

Sanskit Text: इरावती धेनुमती हि भूतं सूयवसिनी मनुषे दशस्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: irāvatī dhenumatī hi bhūtaṃ sūyavasinī manuṣe daśasyā |
Translation: 3 Rich in sweet food be ye, and rich in milch-kine, with fertile pastures, fain to do men service.

Sanskit Text: वय अस्तभ्ना रोदसी विष्णव एते दाधर्थ पर्थिवीम अभितो मयूखैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vy astabhnā rodasī viṣṇav ete dādhartha pṛthivīm abhito mayūkhaiḥ ||
Translation: Both these worlds, Viṣṇu, hast thou stayed asunder, and firmly fixed the earth with pegs around it.

Sanskit Text: उरुं यज्ञाय चक्रथुर उलोकं जनयन्ता सूर्यम उषासम अग्निम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uruṃ yajñāya cakrathur ulokaṃ janayantā sūryam uṣāsam aghnim |
Translation: 4 Ye have made spacious room for sacrificing by generating Sūrya, Dawn, and Agni.

Sanskit Text: दासस्य चिद वर्षशिप्रस्य माया जघ्नथुर नरा पर्तनाज्येषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dāsasya cid vṛṣaśiprasya māyā jaghnathur narā pṛtanājyeṣu ||
Translation: O Heroes, ye have conquered in your battles even the bull-jawed Dāsa's wiles and magic.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राविष्णू दरंहिताः शम्बरस्य नव पुरो नवतिं च शनथिष्टम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāviṣṇū dṛṃhitāḥ śambarasya nava puro navatiṃ ca śnathiṣṭam |
Translation: 5 Ye have destroyed, thou, Indra, and thou Viṣṇu, Śambara's nine-and-ninety fenced castles.

Sanskit Text: शतं वर्चिनः सहस्रं च साकं हथो अप्रत्य असुरस्य वीरान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ varcinaḥ sahasraṃ ca sākaṃ hatho apraty asurasya vīrān ||
Translation: Ye Twain smote down a hundred times a thousand resistless heroes of the royal Varcin.

Sanskit Text: इयम मनीषा बर्हती बर्हन्तोरुक्रमा तवसा वर्धयन्ती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyam manīṣā bṛhatī bṛhantorukramā tavasā vardhayantī |
Translation: 6 This is the lofty hymn of praise, exalting the Lords of Mighty Stride, the strong and lofty.

Sanskit Text: ररे वां सतोमं विदथेषु विष्णो पिन्वतम इषो वर्जनेष्व इन्द्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rare vāṃ stomaṃ vidatheṣu viṣṇo pinvatam iṣo vṛjaneṣv indra ||
Translation: I laud you in the solemn synods, Viṣṇu: pour ye food on us in our camps, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: वषट ते विष्णव आस आ कर्णोमि तन मे जुषस्व शिपिविष्ट हव्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaṣaṭ te viṣṇav āsa ā kṛṇomi tan me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyam |
Translation: 7 O Viṣṇu, unto thee my lips cry Vaṣaṭ! Let this mine offering, Sipivista, please thee.

Sanskit Text: वर्धन्तु तवा सुष्टुतयो गिरो मे यूयम पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vardhantu tvā suṣṭutayo ghiro me yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ ||
Translation: May these my songs of eulogy exalt thee. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: नू मर्तो दयते सनिष्यन यो विष्णव उरुगायाय दाशत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū marto dayate saniṣyan yo viṣṇava urughāyāya dāśat |
Translation: 1 NE’ER doth the man repent, who, seeking profit, bringeth his gift to the far-striding Viṣṇu.

Sanskit Text: पर यः सत्राचा मनसा यजात एतावन्तं नर्यम आविवासात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yaḥ satrācā manasā yajāta etāvantaṃ naryam āvivāsāt ||
Translation: He who adoreth him with all his spirit winneth himself so great a benefactor.

Sanskit Text: तवं विष्णो सुमतिं विश्वजन्याम अप्रयुताम एवयावो मतिं दाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ viṣṇo sumatiṃ viśvajanyām aprayutām evayāvo matiṃ dāḥ |
Translation: 2 Thou, Viṣṇu, constant in thy courses, gavest good-will to all men, and a hymn that lasteth,

Sanskit Text: पर्चो यथा नः सुवितस्य भूरेर अश्वावतः पुरुश्चन्द्रस्य रायः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parco yathā naḥ suvitasya bhūrer aśvāvataḥ puruścandrasya rāyaḥ ||
Translation: That thou mightst move us to abundant comfort of very splendid wealth with store of horses.

Sanskit Text: तरिर देवः पर्थिवीम एष एतां वि चक्रमे शतर्चसम महित्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trir devaḥ pṛthivīm eṣa etāṃ vi cakrame śatarcasam mahitvā |
Translation: 3 Three times strode forth this God in all his grandeur over this earth bright with a hundred splendours.

Sanskit Text: पर विष्णुर अस्तु तवसस तवीयान तवेषं हय अस्य सथविरस्य नाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra viṣṇur astu tavasas tavīyān tveṣaṃ hy asya sthavirasya nāma ||
Translation: Foremost be Viṣṇu, stronger than the strongest: for glorious is his name who lives for ever.

Sanskit Text: वि चक्रमे पर्थिवीम एष एतां कषेत्राय विष्णुर मनुषे दशस्यन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi cakrame pṛthivīm eṣa etāṃ kṣetrāya viṣṇur manuṣe daśasyan |
Translation: 4 Over this earth with mighty step strode Viṣṇu, ready to give it for a home to Manu.

Sanskit Text: धरुवासो अस्य कीरयो जनास उरुक्षितिं सुजनिमा चकार ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhruvāso asya kīrayo janāsa urukṣitiṃ sujanimā cakāra ||
Translation: In him the humble people trust for safety: he, nobly born, hath made them spacious dwellings.

Sanskit Text: पर तत ते अद्य शिपिविष्ट नामार्यः शंसामि वयुनानि विद्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra tat te adya śipiviṣṭa nāmāryaḥ śaṃsāmi vayunāni vidvān |
Translation: 5 To-day I laud this name, O gipivista, I, skilled in rules, the name of thee the Noble.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा गर्णामि तवसम अतव्यान कषयन्तम अस्य रजसः पराके ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā ghṛṇāmi tavasam atavyān kṣayantam asya rajasaḥ parāke ||
Translation: Yea, I the poor and weak praise thee the Mighty who dwellest in the realm beyond this region.

Sanskit Text: किम इत ते विष्णो परिचक्ष्यम भूत पर यद ववक्षे शिपिविष्टो अस्मि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kim it te viṣṇo paricakṣyam bhūt pra yad vavakṣe śipiviṣṭo asmi |
Translation: 6 What was there to be blamed in thee, O Viṣṇu, when thou declaredst, I am Sipivista?

Sanskit Text: मा वर्पो अस्मद अप गूह एतद यद अन्यरूपः समिथे बभूथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā varpo asmad apa ghūha etad yad anyarūpaḥ samithe babhūtha ||
Translation: Hide not this form from us, nor keep it secret, since thou didst wear another shape in battle.

Sanskit Text: वषट ते विष्णव आस आ कर्णोमि तन मे जुषस्व शिपिविष्ट हव्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaṣaṭ te viṣṇav āsa ā kṛṇomi tan me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyam |
Translation: 7 O Viṣṇu, unto thee my lips cry Vaṣaṭ! Let this mine offering, Sipivista, please thee.

Sanskit Text: वर्धन्तु तवा सुष्टुतयो गिरो मे यूयम पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vardhantu tvā suṣṭutayo ghiro me yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ ||
Translation: May these my songs of eulogy exalt thee. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: तिस्रो वाचः पर वद जयोतिरग्रा या एतद दुह्रे मधुदोघम ऊधः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisro vācaḥ pra vada jyotiraghrā yā etad duhre madhudogham ūdhaḥ |
Translation: 1 SPEAK forth three words, the words which light precedeth, which milk this udder that produceth nectar.

Sanskit Text: स वत्सं कर्ण्वन गर्भम ओषधीनां सद्यो जातो वर्षभो रोरवीति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vatsaṃ kṛṇvan gharbham oṣadhīnāṃ sadyo jāto vṛṣabho roravīti ||
Translation: Quickly made manifest, the Bull hath bellowed, engendering the germ of plants, the Infant.

Sanskit Text: यो वर्धन ओषधीनां यो अपां यो विश्वस्य जगतो देव ईशे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vardhana oṣadhīnāṃ yo apāṃ yo viśvasya jaghato deva īśe |
Translation: 2 Giver of growth to plants, the God who ruleth over the waters and all moving creatures,

Sanskit Text: स तरिधातु शरणं शर्म यंसत तरिवर्तु जयोतिः सवभिष्ट्य अस्मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tridhātu śaraṇaṃ śarma yaṃsat trivartu jyotiḥ svabhiṣṭy asme ||
Translation: Vouchsafe us triple shelter for our refuge, and threefold light to succour and befriend us.

Sanskit Text: सतरीर उ तवद भवति सूत उ तवद यथावशं तन्वं चक्र एषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: starīr u tvad bhavati sūta u tvad yathāvaśaṃ tanvaṃ cakra eṣaḥ |
Translation: 3 Now he is sterile, now begetteth offspring, even as he willeth doth he change his figure.

Sanskit Text: पितुः पयः परति गर्भ्णाति माता तेन पिता वर्धते तेन पुत्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pituḥ payaḥ prati ghṛbhṇāti mātā tena pitā vardhate tena putraḥ ||
Translation: The Father's genial flow bedews the Mother; therewith the Sire, therewith the son is nourished.

Sanskit Text: यस्मिन विश्वानि भुवनानि तस्थुस तिस्रो दयावस तरेधा सस्रुर आपः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasmin viśvāni bhuvanāni tasthus tisro dyāvas tredhā sasrur āpaḥ |
Translation: 4 In him all living creatures have their being, and the three heavens with triply-flowing waters.

Sanskit Text: तरयः कोशास उपसेचनासो मध्व शचोतन्त्य अभितो विरप्शम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trayaḥ kośāsa upasecanāso madhva ścotanty abhito virapśam ||
Translation: Three reservoirs that sprinkle down their treasure shed their sweet streams around him with a murmur.

Sanskit Text: इदं वचः पर्जन्याय सवराजे हर्दो अस्त्व अन्तरं तज जुजोषत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ vacaḥ parjanyāya svarāje hṛdo astv antaraṃ taj jujoṣat |
Translation: 5 May this my song to Sovran Lord Parjanya come near unto his heart and give him pleasure.

Sanskit Text: मयोभुवो वर्ष्टयः सन्त्व अस्मे सुपिप्पला ओषधीर देवगोपाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mayobhuvo vṛṣṭayaḥ santv asme supippalā oṣadhīr devaghopāḥ ||
Translation: May we obtain the showers that bring enjoyment, and God-protected plants with goodly fruitage.

Sanskit Text: स रेतोधा वर्षभः शश्वतीनां तस्मिन्न आत्मा जगतस तस्थुषश च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa retodhā vṛṣabhaḥ śaśvatīnāṃ tasminn ātmā jaghatas tasthuṣaś ca |
Translation: 6 He is the Bull of all, and their impregner: he holds the life of all things fixed and moving.

Sanskit Text: तन म रतम पातु शतशारदाय यूयम पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan ma ṛtam pātu śataśāradāya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ ||
Translation: May this rite save me till my hundredth autumn. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रासोमा समघशंसमभ्यघं तपुर्ययस्तु चरुरग्निवानिव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parā sṛṇītamacito nyoṣataṃ hataṃ nudethāṃ ni śiśītamatriṇaḥ ||
Translation: 1. INDRA and Soma, burn, destroy the demon foe, send downward, O ye Bulls, those who add gloom to gloom.

Sanskit Text: बरह्मद्विषे करव्यादे घोरचक्षसे दवेषो धत्तमनवायं किमीदिने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāsomā samaghaśaṃsamabhyaghaṃ tapuryayastu caruraghnivāniva |
Translation: Annihilate the fools, slay them and burn them up: chase them away from us, pierce the voracious ones.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रासोमा दुष्क्र्तो वव्रे अन्तरनारम्भणे तमसि पर विध्यतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmadviṣe kravyāde ghoracakṣase dveṣo dhattamanavāyaṃ kimīdine ||
Translation: 2 Indra and Soma, let sin round the wicked boil like as a caldron set amid the flames of fire.

Sanskit Text: यथा नातः पुनरेकश्चनोदयत तद वामस्तु सहसे मन्युमच्छवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāsomā duṣkṛto vavre antaranārambhaṇe tamasi pra vidhyatam |
Translation: Against the foe of prayer, devourer of raw flesh, the vile fiend fierce of eye, keep ye perpetual hate.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रासोमा वर्तयतं दिवो वधं सं पर्थिव्या अघशंसाय तर्हणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā nātaḥ punarekaścanodayat tad vāmastu sahase manyumacchavaḥ ||
Translation: 3 Indra and Soma, plunge the wicked in the depth, yea, cast them into darkness that hath no support,

Sanskit Text: उत तक्षतं सवर्यं पर्वतेभ्यो येन रक्षो वाव्र्धानं निजूर्वथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāsomā vartayataṃ divo vadhaṃ saṃ pṛthivyā aghaśaṃsāya tarhaṇam |
Translation: So that not one of them may ever thence return: so may your wrathful might prevail and conquer them.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रासोमा वर्तयतं दिवस पर्यग्नितप्तेभिर्युवमश्महन्मभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut takṣataṃ svaryaṃ parvatebhyo yena rakṣo vāvṛdhānaṃ nijūrvathaḥ ||
Translation: 4 Indra and Soma, hurl your deadly crushing bolt down on the wicked fiend from heaven and from the earth.

Sanskit Text: तपुर्वधेभिरजरेभिरत्रिणो नि पर्शाने विध्यतं यन्तु निस्वरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāsomā vartayataṃ divas paryaghnitaptebhiryuvamaśmahanmabhiḥ |
Translation: Yea, forge out of the mountains your celestial dart wherewith ye burn to death the waxing demon race.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रासोमा परि वां भूतु विश्वत इयं मतिः कक्ष्याश्वेववाजिना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tapurvadhebhirajarebhiratriṇo ni parśāne vidhyataṃ yantu nisvaram ||
Translation: 5 Indra and Soma, cast ye downward out of heaven your deadly darts of stone burning with fiery flame,

Sanskit Text: यां वां होत्रां परिहिनोमि मेधयेमा बरह्माणि नर्पतीव जिन्वतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāsomā pari vāṃ bhūtu viśvata iyaṃ matiḥ kakṣyāśvevavājinā |
Translation: Eternal, scorching darts; plunge the voracious ones within the depth, and let them sink without a sound.

Sanskit Text: परति समरेथां तुजयद्भिरेवैर्हतं दरुहो रक्षसो भङगुरावतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāṃ vāṃ hotrāṃ parihinomi medhayemā brahmāṇi nṛpatīva jinvatam ||
Translation: 6 Indra and Soma, let this hymn control you both, even as the girth encompasses two vigorous steeds-

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रासोमा दुष्क्र्ते मा सुगं भूद यो नः कदाचिदभिदासति दरुहा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati smarethāṃ tujayadbhirevairhataṃ druho rakṣaso bhaṅghurāvataḥ |
Translation: The song of praise which I with wisdom offer you: do ye, as Lords of men, animate these my prayers.

Sanskit Text: यो मा पाकेन मनसा चरन्तमभिचष्टे अन्र्तेभिर्वचोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāsomā duṣkṛte mā sughaṃ bhūd yo naḥ kadācidabhidāsati druhā ||
Translation: 7 In your impetuous manner think ye both thereon: destroy these evil beings, slay the treacherous fiends.

Sanskit Text: आप इव काशिना संग्र्भीता असन्नस्त्वासत इन्द्र वक्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo mā pākena manasā carantamabhicaṣṭe anṛtebhirvacobhiḥ |
Translation: Indra and Soma, let the wicked have no bliss who evermore assails us with malignity.

Sanskit Text: ये पाकशंसं विहरन्त एवैर्ये वा भद्रं दूषयन्ति सवधाभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpa iva kāśinā saṃghṛbhītā asannastvāsata indra vaktā ||
Translation: 8 Whoso accuses me with words of falsehood when I pursue my way with guileless spirit,

Sanskit Text: अहये वा तान परददातु सोम आ वा दधातु निरतेरुपस्थे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye pākaśaṃsaṃ viharanta evairye vā bhadraṃ dūṣayanti svadhābhiḥ |
Translation: May he, the speaker of untruth, be, Indra, like water which the hollowed hand compresses.

Sanskit Text: यो नो रसं दिप्सति पित्वो अग्ने यो अश्वानां यो गवां यस्तनूनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaye vā tān pradadātu soma ā vā dadhātu nirterupasthe ||
Translation: 9 Those who destroy, as is their wont, the simple, and with their evil natures barm the righteous,

Sanskit Text: रिपु सतेन सतेयक्र्द दभ्रमेतु नि ष हीयतान्तन्वा तना च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo no rasaṃ dipsati pitvo aghne yo aśvānāṃ yo ghavāṃ yastanūnām |
Translation: May Soma give them over to the serpent, or to the lap of Nirrti consign them.

Sanskit Text: परः सो अस्तु तन्वा तना च तिस्रः पर्थिवीरधो अस्तु विश्वाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ripu stena steyakṛd dabhrametu ni ṣa hīyatāntanvā tanā ca ||
Translation: 10 The fiend, O Agni, who designs to injure the essence of our food, kine, steeds, or bodies,

Sanskit Text: परति शुष्यतु यशो अस्य देवा यो नो दिवा दिप्सति यश्च नक्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: paraḥ so astu tanvā tanā ca tisraḥ pṛthivīradho astu viśvāḥ |
Translation: May he, the adversary, thief, and robber, sink to destruction, both himself and offipring.

Sanskit Text: सुविज्ञानं चिकितुषे जनाय सच्चासच्च वचसी पस्प्र्धाते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati śuṣyatu yaśo asya devā yo no divā dipsati yaśca naktam ||
Translation: 11 May he be swept away, himself and children: may all the three earths press him down beneath them.

Sanskit Text: तयोर्यत सत्यं यतरद रजीयस्तदित सोमो.अवति हन्त्यासत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvijñānaṃ cikituṣe janāya saccāsacca vacasī paspṛdhāte |
Translation: May his fair glory, O ye Gods, be blighted, who in the day or night would fain destroy us.

Sanskit Text: ना वा उ सोमो वर्जिनं हिनोति न कषत्रियं मिथुया धारयन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tayoryat satyaṃ yatarad ṛjīyastadit somo.avati hantyāsat ||
Translation: 12 The prudent finds it easy to distinguish the true and false: their words oppose each other.

Sanskit Text: हन्ति रक्षो हन्त्यासद वदन्तमुभाविन्द्रस्य परसितौ शयाते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nā vā u somo vṛjinaṃ hinoti na kṣatriyaṃ mithuyā dhārayantam |
Translation: Of these two that which is the true and honest, Soma protects, and brings the false to nothing.

Sanskit Text: यदि वाहमन्र्तदेव आस मोघं वा देवानप्यूहे अग्ने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hanti rakṣo hantyāsad vadantamubhāvindrasya prasitau śayāte ||
Translation: 13 Never doth Soma aid and guide the wicked or him who falsely claims the Warrior's title.

Sanskit Text: किमस्मभ्यं जातवेदो हर्णीषे दरोघवाचस्ते निरथं सचन्ताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadi vāhamanṛtadeva āsa moghaṃ vā devānapyūhe aghne |
Translation: He slays the fiend and him who speaks untruly: both lie entangled in the noose of Indra.

Sanskit Text: अद्या मुरीय यदि यातुधानो अस्मि यदि वायुस्ततप पूरुषस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kimasmabhyaṃ jātavedo hṛṇīṣe droghavācaste nirthaṃ sacantām ||
Translation: 14 As if I worshipped deities of falsehood, or thought vain thoughts about the Gods, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: अधा स वीरैर्दशभिर्वि यूया यो मा मोघं यातुधानेत्याह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adyā murīya yadi yātudhāno asmi yadi vāyustatapa pūruṣasya |
Translation: Why art thou angry with us, Jātavedas? Destruction fall on those who lie against thee!

Sanskit Text: यो मायातुं यातुधानेत्याह यो वा रक्षाः शुचिरस्मीत्याह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā sa vīrairdaśabhirvi yūyā yo mā moghaṃ yātudhānetyāha ||
Translation: 15 So may I die this day if I have harassed any man's life or if I be a demon.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्तं हन्तु महता वधेन विश्वस्य जन्तोरधमस पदीष्ट ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo māyātuṃ yātudhānetyāha yo vā rakṣāḥ śucirasmītyāha |
Translation: Yea, may he lose all his ten sons together who with false tongue hath called me Yātudhāna.

Sanskit Text: पर या जिगाति खर्गलेव नक्तमप दरुहा तन्वं गूहमाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrastaṃ hantu mahatā vadhena viśvasya jantoradhamas padīṣṭa ||
Translation: 16 May Indra slay him with a mighty weapon, and let the vilest of all creatures perish,

Sanskit Text: वव्राननन्तानव सा पदीष्ट गरावाणो घनन्तु रक्षस उपब्दैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yā jighāti kharghaleva naktamapa druhā tanvaṃ ghūhamānā |
Translation: The fiend who says that he is pure, who calls me a demon though devoid of demon nature.

Sanskit Text: वि तिष्ठध्वं मरुतो विक्ष्विछत गर्भायत रक्षसः सं पिनष्टन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vavrānanantānava sā padīṣṭa ghrāvāṇo ghnantu rakṣasa upabdaiḥ ||
Translation: 17 She too who wanders like an owl at night-time, hiding her body in her guile and malice,

Sanskit Text: वयो ये भूत्वी पतयन्ति नक्तभिर्ये वा रिपो दधिरे देवे अध्वरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi tiṣṭhadhvaṃ maruto vikṣvichata ghṛbhāyata rakṣasaḥ saṃ pinaṣṭana |
Translation: May she fall downward into endless caverns. May press-stones with loud ring destroy the demons.

Sanskit Text: पर वर्तय दिवो अश्मानमिन्द्र सोमशितं मघवन सं शिशाधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayo ye bhūtvī patayanti naktabhirye vā ripo dadhire deve adhvare ||
Translation: 18 Spread out, ye Maruts, search among the people: seize ye and grind the Rākṣasas to pieces,

Sanskit Text: पराक्तादपाक्तादधरादुदक्तादभि जहि रक्षसःपर्वतेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vartaya divo aśmānamindra somaśitaṃ maghavan saṃ śiśādhi |
Translation: Who fly abroad, transformed to birds, at night-time, or sully and pollute our holy worship.

Sanskit Text: एत उ तये पतयन्ति शवयातव इन्द्रं दिप्सन्ति दिप्सवो.अदाभ्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāktādapāktādadharādudaktādabhi jahi rakṣasaḥparvatena ||
Translation: 19 Hurl down from heaven thy bolt of stone, O Indra: sharpen it, Maghavan, made keen by Soma.

Sanskit Text: शिशीते शक्रः पिशुनेभ्यो वधं नूनं सर्जदशनिं यातुमद्भ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eta u tye patayanti śvayātava indraṃ dipsanti dipsavo.adābhyam |
Translation: Forward, behind, and from above and under, smite down the demons with thy rocky weapon.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो यातूनामभवत पराशरो हविर्मथीनामभ्याविवासताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śiśīte śakraḥ piśunebhyo vadhaṃ nūnaṃ sṛjadaśaniṃ yātumadbhyaḥ ||
Translation: 20 They fly, the demon dogs, and, bent on mischief, fain would they harm indomitable Indra.

Sanskit Text: अभीदु शक्रः परशुर्यथा वनं पात्रेव भिन्दन सत एति रक्षसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro yātūnāmabhavat parāśaro havirmathīnāmabhyāvivāsatām |
Translation: Śakra makes sharp his weapon for the wicked: now, let him cast his bolt at fiendish wizards.

Sanskit Text: उलूकयातुं शुशुलूकयातुं जहि शवयातुमुत कोकयातुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhīdu śakraḥ paraśuryathā vanaṃ pātreva bhindan sata eti rakṣasaḥ ||
Translation: 21 Indra hath ever been the fiends’ destroyer who spoil oblations of the Gods’ invokers:

Sanskit Text: सुपर्णयातुमुत गर्ध्रयातुं दर्षदेव पर मर्ण रक्ष इन्द्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ulūkayātuṃ śuśulūkayātuṃ jahi śvayātumuta kokayātum |
Translation: Yea, Śakra, like an axe that

Sanskit Text: <a href="errata.htm#19">
splits
the timber, attacks and smashes them like earthen vessels.
मा नो रक्षो अभि नड यातुमावतामपोछतु मिथुना या किमीदिना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suparṇayātumuta ghṛdhrayātuṃ dṛṣadeva pra mṛṇa rakṣa indra ||
Translation: 22 Destroy the fiend shaped like an owl or owlet, destroy him in the form of dog or cuckoo.

Sanskit Text: पर्थिवी नः पार्थिवात पात्वंहसो.अन्तरिक्षं दिव्यात पात्वस्मान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no rakṣo abhi naḍ yātumāvatāmapochatu mithunā yā kimīdinā |
Translation: Destroy him shaped as eagle or as vulture as with a stone, O Indra, crush the demon.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र जहि पुमांसं यातुधानमुत सत्रियं मायया शाशदानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛthivī naḥ pārthivāt pātvaṃhaso.antarikṣaṃ divyāt pātvasmān ||
Translation: 23 Let not the fiend of witchcraft-workers reach us: may Dawn drive off the couples of Kimīdins.

Sanskit Text: विग्रीवासो मूरदेवा रदन्तु मा ते दर्शं सूर्यमुच्चरन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra jahi pumāṃsaṃ yātudhānamuta striyaṃ māyayā śāśadānām |
Translation: Earth keep us safe from earthly woe and trouble: from grief that comes from heaven mid-air preserve us.

Sanskit Text: परति चक्ष्व वि चक्ष्वेन्द्रश्च सोम जाग्र्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vighrīvāso mūradevā ṛdantu mā te dṛśaṃ sūryamuccarantam ||
Translation: 24 Slay the male demon, Indra! slay the female, joying and triumphing in arts of magic.

Sanskit Text: रक्षोभ्यो वधमस्यतमशनिं यातुमद्भ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati cakṣva vi cakṣvendraśca soma jāghṛtam |
Translation: Let the fools' gods with bent necks fall and perish, and see no more the Sun when he arises.

Sanskit Text: indrāsomā tapataṃ rakṣa ubjataṃ nyarpayataṃ vṛṣaṇā tamovṛdhaḥ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rakṣobhyo vadhamasyatamaśaniṃ yātumadbhyaḥ ||
Translation: 25 Look each one hither, look around Indra and Soma, watch ye well.

Sanskit Text: मा चिदन्यद वि शंसत सखायो मा रिषण्यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā cidanyad vi śaṃsata sakhāyo mā riṣaṇyata |
Translation: 1. GLORIFY naught besides, O friends; so shall no sorrow trouble you.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रमित्स्तोता वर्षणं सचा सुते मुहुरुक्था च शंसत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indramitstotā vṛṣaṇaṃ sacā sute muhurukthā ca śaṃsata ||
Translation: Praise only mighty Indra when the juice is shed, and say your lauds repeatedly:

Sanskit Text: अवक्रक्षिणं वर्षभं यथाजुरं गां न चर्षणीसहम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avakrakṣiṇaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ yathājuraṃ ghāṃ na carṣaṇīsaham |
Translation: 2 Even him, eternal, like a bull who rushes down, men's Conqueror, bounteous like a cow;

Sanskit Text: विद्वेषणं संवननोभयंकरं मंहिष्ठमुभयाविनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidveṣaṇaṃ saṃvananobhayaṃkaraṃ maṃhiṣṭhamubhayāvinam ||
Translation: Him who is cause of both, of enmity and peace, to both sides most munificent.

Sanskit Text: यच्चिद धि तवा जना इमे नाना हवन्त ऊतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaccid dhi tvā janā ime nānā havanta ūtaye |
Translation: 3 Although these men in sundry ways invoke thee to obtain thine aid,

Sanskit Text: अस्माकं बरह्मेदमिन्द्र भूतु ते.अह विश्वा च वर्धनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākaṃ brahmedamindra bhūtu te.aha viśvā ca vardhanam ||
Translation: Be this our prayer, addressed, O Indra, unto thee, thine exaltation every day.

Sanskit Text: वि तर्तूर्यन्ते मघवन विपश्चितो.अर्यो विपो जनानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi tartūryante maghavan vipaścito.aryo vipo janānām |
Translation: 4 Those skilled in song, O Maghavan among these men o’ercome with might the foeman's songs.

Sanskit Text: उप करमस्व पुरुरूपमा भर वाजं नेदिष्ठमूतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa kramasva pururūpamā bhara vājaṃ nediṣṭhamūtaye ||
Translation: Come hither, bring us strength in many a varied form most near that it may succour us.

Sanskit Text: महे चन तवामद्रिवः परा शुल्काय देयाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahe cana tvāmadrivaḥ parā śulkāya deyām |
Translation: 5 O Caster of the Stone, I would not sell thee for a mighty price,

Sanskit Text: न सहस्रायनायुताय वज्रिवो न शताय शतामघ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na sahasrāyanāyutāya vajrivo na śatāya śatāmagha ||
Translation: Not for a thousand, Thunderer! nor ten thousand, nor a hundred, Lord of countless wealth!

Sanskit Text: वस्यानिन्द्रासि मे पितुरुत भरातुरभुञ्जतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasyānindrāsi me pituruta bhrāturabhuñjataḥ |
Translation: 6 O Indra, thou art more to me than sire or niggard brother is.

Sanskit Text: माता चमे छदयथः समा वसो वसुत्वनाय राधसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mātā came chadayathaḥ samā vaso vasutvanāya rādhase ||
Translation: Thou and my mother, O Good Lord, appear alike, to give me wealth abundantly.

Sanskit Text: कवेयथ कवेदसि पुरुत्रा चिद धि ते मनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kveyatha kvedasi purutrā cid dhi te manaḥ |
Translation: 7 Where art thou? Whither art thou gone? For many a place attracts thy mind.

Sanskit Text: अलर्षि युध्म खजक्र्त पुरन्दर पर गायत्रा अगासिषुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: alarṣi yudhma khajakṛt purandara pra ghāyatrā aghāsiṣuḥ ||
Translation: Haste, Warrior, Fort-destroyer, Lord of battle's din, haste, holy songs have sounded forth.

Sanskit Text: परास्मै गायत्रमर्चत वावातुर्यः पुरन्दरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāsmai ghāyatramarcata vāvāturyaḥ purandaraḥ |
Translation: 8 Sing out the psalm to him who breaks down castles for his faithful friend,

Sanskit Text: याभिःकाण्वस्योप बर्हिरासदं यासद वज्री भिनत पुरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥkāṇvasyopa barhirāsadaṃ yāsad vajrī bhinat puraḥ ||
Translation: Verses to bring the Thunderer to destroy the forts and sit on Kaṇva's sacred grass.

Sanskit Text: ये ते सन्ति दशग्विनः शतिनो ये सहस्रिणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye te santi daśaghvinaḥ śatino ye sahasriṇaḥ |
Translation: 9 The Horses which are thine in tens, in hundreds, yea, in thousands thine,

Sanskit Text: अश्वासो येते वर्षणो रघुद्रुवस्तेभिर्नस्तूयमा गहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvāso yete vṛṣaṇo raghudruvastebhirnastūyamā ghahi ||
Translation: Even those vigorous Steeds, fleet-footed in the course, with those come quickly near to us.

Sanskit Text: आ तवद्य सबर्दुघां हुवे गायत्रवेपसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tvadya sabardughāṃ huve ghāyatravepasam |
Translation: 10 This day I call Sabardughā who animates the holy song,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं धेनुंसुदुघामन्यामिषमुरुधारामरंक्र्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ dhenuṃsudughāmanyāmiṣamurudhārāmaraṃkṛtam ||
Translation: Indra the richly-yielding Milch-cow who provides unfailing food in ample stream.

Sanskit Text: यत तुदत सूर एतशं वङकू वातस्य पर्णिना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat tudat sūra etaśaṃ vaṅkū vātasya parṇinā |
Translation: 11 When Sūra wounded Etaśa, with Vāta's rolling winged car.

Sanskit Text: वहत कुत्समार्जुनेयं शतक्रतुः तसरद गन्धर्वमस्त्र्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vahat kutsamārjuneyaṃ śatakratuḥ tsarad ghandharvamastṛtam ||
Translation: Indra bore Kutsa Ārjuneya off, and mocked Gandharva. the unconquered One.

Sanskit Text: य रते चिदभिश्रिषः पुरा जत्रुभ्य आत्र्दः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya ṛte cidabhiśriṣaḥ purā jatrubhya ātṛdaḥ |
Translation: 12 He without ligature, before making incision in the neck,

Sanskit Text: सन्धातासन्धिं मघवा पुरूवसुरिष्कर्ता विह्रुतं पुनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sandhātāsandhiṃ maghavā purūvasuriṣkartā vihrutaṃ punaḥ ||
Translation: Closed up the wound again, most wealthy Maghavan, who maketh whole the injured part.

Sanskit Text: मा भूम निष्ट्या इवेन्द्र तवदरणा इव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā bhūma niṣṭyā ivendra tvadaraṇā iva |
Translation: 13 May we be never cast aside, and strangers, as it were, to thee.

Sanskit Text: वनानि न परजहितान्यद्रिवो दुरोषासो अमन्महि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanāni na prajahitānyadrivo duroṣāso amanmahi ||
Translation: We, Thunder-wielding Indra, count ourselves as trees rejected and unfit to burn.

Sanskit Text: अमन्महीदनाशवो.अनुग्रासश्च वर्त्रहन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: amanmahīdanāśavo.anughrāsaśca vṛtrahan |
Translation: 14 O Vṛtra-slayer, we were thought slow and unready for the fray.

Sanskit Text: सक्र्त सु ते महता शूर राधसानु सतोमं मुदीमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakṛt su te mahatā śūra rādhasānu stomaṃ mudīmahi ||
Translation: Yet once in thy great bounty may we have delight, O Hero, after praising thee.

Sanskit Text: यदि सतोमं मम शरवदस्माकमिन्द्रमिन्दवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadi stomaṃ mama śravadasmākamindramindavaḥ |
Translation: 15 If he will listen to my laud, then may out Soma-drops that flow

Sanskit Text: तिरः पवित्रं सस्र्वांस आशवो मन्दन्तु तुग्र्याव्र्धः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tiraḥ pavitraṃ sasṛvāṃsa āśavo mandantu tughryāvṛdhaḥ ||
Translation: Rapidly through the strainer gladden Indra, drops due to the Tugryas’ Strengthener.

Sanskit Text: आ तवद्य सधस्तुतिं वावातुः सख्युरा गहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tvadya sadhastutiṃ vāvātuḥ sakhyurā ghahi |
Translation: 16 Come now unto the common laud of thee and of thy faithful friend.

Sanskit Text: उपस्तुतिर्मघोनां पर तवावत्वधा ते वश्मि सुष्टुतिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upastutirmaghonāṃ pra tvāvatvadhā te vaśmi suṣṭutim ||
Translation: So may our wealthy nobles’ praise give joy to thee. Fain would I sing thine eulogy.

Sanskit Text: सोता हि सोममद्रिभिरेमेनमप्सु धावत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sotā hi somamadribhiremenamapsu dhāvata |
Translation: 17 Press out the Soma with the stones, and in the waters wash it clean.

Sanskit Text: गव्या वस्त्रेव वासयन्त इन नरो निर्धुक्षन वक्षणाभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghavyā vastreva vāsayanta in naro nirdhukṣan vakṣaṇābhyaḥ ||
Translation: The men investing it with raiment made of milk shall milk it forth from out the stems.

Sanskit Text: अध जमो अध वा दिवो बर्हतो रोचनादधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha jmo adha vā divo bṛhato rocanādadhi |
Translation: 18 Whether thou come from earth or from the lustre of the lofty heaven,

Sanskit Text: अया वर्धस्व तन्वा गिरा ममा जाता सुक्रतो पर्ण ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayā vardhasva tanvā ghirā mamā jātā sukrato pṛṇa ||
Translation: Wax stronger in thy body through my song of praise: fill full all creatures, O most Wise.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय सु मदिन्तमं सोमं सोता वरेण्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya su madintamaṃ somaṃ sotā vareṇyam |
Translation: 19 For India press the Soma out, most gladdening and most excellent.

Sanskit Text: शक्र एणं पीपयद विश्वया धिया हिन्वानं न वाजयुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śakra eṇaṃ pīpayad viśvayā dhiyā hinvānaṃ na vājayum ||
Translation: May Śakra make it swell sent forth with every prayer and asking, as it were, for strength.
