Sanskit Text: मा तवा सोमस्य गल्दया सदा याचन्नहं गिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā tvā somasya ghaldayā sadā yācannahaṃ ghirā |
Translation: 20 Let me not, still beseeching thee with earnest song at Soma rites,

Sanskit Text: भूर्णिं मर्गं न सवनेषु चुक्रुधं क ईशानं न याचिषत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūrṇiṃ mṛghaṃ na savaneṣu cukrudhaṃ ka īśānaṃ na yāciṣat ||
Translation: Anger thee like

Sanskit Text: <a href="errata.htm#20">
some
wild beast. Who would not beseech him who hath power to grant his prayer?
मदेनेषितं मदमुग्रमुग्रेण शवसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: madeneṣitaṃ madamughramughreṇa śavasā |
Translation: 21 The draught made swift with rapturous joy, effectual with its mighty strength,

Sanskit Text: विश्वेषां तरुतारं मदच्युतं मदे हि षमा ददाति नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśveṣāṃ tarutāraṃ madacyutaṃ made hi ṣmā dadāti naḥ ||
Translation: All-conquering, distilling transport, let him drink: for he in ecstasy gives us gifts.

Sanskit Text: शेवारे वार्या पुरु देवो मर्ताय दाशुषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śevāre vāryā puru devo martāya dāśuṣe |
Translation: 22 Where bliss is not, may he, All-praised, God whom the pious glorify,

Sanskit Text: स सुन्वते चस्तुवते च रासते विश्वगूर्तो अरिष्टुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sunvate castuvate ca rāsate viśvaghūrto ariṣṭutaḥ ||
Translation: Bestow great wealth upon the mortal worshipper who sheds the juice and praises him.

Sanskit Text: एन्द्र याहि मत्स्व चित्रेण देव राधसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: endra yāhi matsva citreṇa deva rādhasā |
Translation: 23 Come, Indra, and rejoice thyself, O God, in manifold affluence.

Sanskit Text: सरो न परास्युदरं सपीतिभिरा सोमेभिरुरु सफिरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saro na prāsyudaraṃ sapītibhirā somebhiruru sphiram ||
Translation: Thou fillest like a lake thy vast capacious bulk with Soma and with draughts besides.

Sanskit Text: आ तवा सहस्रमा शतं युक्ता रथे हिरण्यये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tvā sahasramā śataṃ yuktā rathe hiraṇyaye |
Translation: 24 A thousand and a hundred Steeds are harnessed to thy golden car.

Sanskit Text: बरह्मयुजो हरय इन्द्र केशिनो वहन्तु सोमपीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmayujo haraya indra keśino vahantu somapītaye ||
Translation: So may the long-maned Bays, yoked by devotion, bring Indra to drink the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: आ तवा रथे हिरण्यये हरी मयूरशेप्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tvā rathe hiraṇyaye harī mayūraśepyā |
Translation: 25 Yoked to thy chariot wrought of gold, may thy two Bays with peacock tails,

Sanskit Text: शितिप्र्ष्ठा वहतां मध्वो अन्धसो विवक्षणस्य पीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śitipṛṣṭhā vahatāṃ madhvo andhaso vivakṣaṇasya pītaye ||
Translation: Convey thee hither, Steeds with their white backs, to quaff sweet juice that makes us eloquent.

Sanskit Text: पिबा तवस्य गिर्वणः सुतस्य पूर्वपा इव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibā tvasya ghirvaṇaḥ sutasya pūrvapā iva |
Translation: 26 So drink, thou Lover of the Song, as the first drinker, of this juice.

Sanskit Text: परिष्क्र्तस्य रसिन इयमासुतिश्चारुर्मदाय पत्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pariṣkṛtasya rasina iyamāsutiścārurmadāya patyate ||
Translation: This the outpouring of the savoury sap prepared is good and meet to gladden thee.

Sanskit Text: य एको अस्ति दंसना महानुग्रो अभि वरतैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya eko asti daṃsanā mahānughro abhi vrataiḥ |
Translation: 27 He who alone by wondrous deed is Mighty, Strong by holy works,

Sanskit Text: गमत स शिप्री न स योषदा गमद धवं न परि वर्जति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghamat sa śiprī na sa yoṣadā ghamad dhavaṃ na pari varjati ||
Translation: May he come, fair of cheek; may he not stay afar, but come and turn not from our call.

Sanskit Text: तवं पुरं चरिष्ण्वं वधैः शुष्णस्य सं पिणक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ puraṃ cariṣṇvaṃ vadhaiḥ śuṣṇasya saṃ piṇak |
Translation: 28 Śuṣṇa's quick moving castle thou hast crushed to pieces with thy bolts.

Sanskit Text: तवम्भा अनु चरो अध दविता यदिन्द्र हव्यो भुवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvambhā anu caro adha dvitā yadindra havyo bhuvaḥ ||
Translation: Thou, Indra, from of old, hast followed after light, since we have had thee to invoke.

Sanskit Text: मम तवा सूर उदिते मम मध्यन्दिने दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mama tvā sūra udite mama madhyandine divaḥ |
Translation: 29 My praises when the Sun hath risen, my praises at the time of noon,

Sanskit Text: मम परपित्वेपिशर्वरे वसवा सतोमासो अव्र्त्सत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mama prapitveapiśarvare vasavā stomāso avṛtsata ||
Translation: My praises at the coming of the gloom of night, O Vasu, have gone forth to thee.

Sanskit Text: सतुहि सतुहीदेते घा ते मंहिष्ठासो मघोनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stuhi stuhīdete ghā te maṃhiṣṭhāso maghonām |
Translation: 30 Praise yea, praise him. Of princes these are the most liberal of their gifts,

Sanskit Text: निन्दिताश्वः परपथी परमज्या मघस्य मेध्यातिथे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ninditāśvaḥ prapathī paramajyā maghasya medhyātithe ||
Translation: These, Paramajyā, Ninditāśva, Prapathī, most bounteous, O Medhyātithi.

Sanskit Text: आ यदश्वान वनन्वतः शरद्धयाहं रथे रुहम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yadaśvān vananvataḥ śraddhayāhaṃ rathe ruham |
Translation: 31 When to the car, by faith, I yoked the horses longing for the way-

Sanskit Text: उतवामस्य वसुनश्चिकेतति यो अस्ति याद्वः पशुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utavāmasya vasunaściketati yo asti yādvaḥ paśuḥ ||
Translation: For skilled is Yadu's son in dealing precious wealth, he who is rich in herds of kine.

Sanskit Text: य रज्रा मह्यं मामहे सह तवचा हिरण्यया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya ṛjrā mahyaṃ māmahe saha tvacā hiraṇyayā |
Translation: 32 May he who gave me two brown steeds together with their cloths of gold,

Sanskit Text: एष विश्वान्यभ्यस्तु सौभगासङगस्य सवनद्रथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa viśvānyabhyastu saubhaghāsaṅghasya svanadrathaḥ ||
Translation: May he, Āsaṅga's son Svanadratha, obtain all joy and high felicities.

Sanskit Text: अध पलायोगिरति दासदन्यानासङगो अग्ने दशभिः सहस्रैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha plāyoghirati dāsadanyānāsaṅgho aghne daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ |
Translation: 33 Playoga's son Āsaṅga, by ten thousand, O Agni, hath surpassed the rest in giving.

Sanskit Text: अधोक्षणो दश मह्यं रुशन्तो नळा इव सरसो निरतिष्ठन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhokṣaṇo daśa mahyaṃ ruśanto naḷā iva saraso niratiṣṭhan ||
Translation: For me ten bright-hued oxen have come forward like lotus-stalks from out a lake upstanding.

Sanskit Text: अन्वस्य सथूरं दद्र्शे पुरस्तादनस्थ ऊरुरवरम्बमाणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anvasya sthūraṃ dadṛśe purastādanastha ūruravarambamāṇaḥ |
Translation: 34 What time her husband's perfect restoration to his lost strength and manhood was apparent,

Sanskit Text: शश्वती नार्यभिचक्ष्याह सुभद्रमर्य भोजनं बिभर्षि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaśvatī nāryabhicakṣyāha subhadramarya bhojanaṃ bibharṣi ||
Translation: His consort Śaśvatī with joy addressed him, Now art thou well, my lord, and shalt be happy.

Sanskit Text: इदं वसो सुतमन्धः पिबा सुपूर्णमुदरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ vaso sutamandhaḥ pibā supūrṇamudaram |
Translation: 1. HERE is the Soma juice expressed; O Vasu, drink till thou art full:

Sanskit Text: अनाभयिन ररिमा ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anābhayin rarimā te ||
Translation: Undaunted God, we give it thee.

Sanskit Text: नर्भिर्धूतः सुतो अश्नैरव्यो वारैः परिपूतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛbhirdhūtaḥ suto aśnairavyo vāraiḥ paripūtaḥ |
Translation: 2 Washed by the men, pressed out with stones, strained through the filter made of wool,

Sanskit Text: अश्वोन निक्तो नदीषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvona nikto nadīṣu ||
Translation: ’Tis like a courser bathed in stream.

Sanskit Text: तं ते यवं यथा गोभिः सवादुमकर्म शरीणन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ te yavaṃ yathā ghobhiḥ svādumakarma śrīṇantaḥ |
Translation: 3 This juice have we made sweet for thee like barley, blending it with milk.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र तवास्मिन सधमादे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra tvāsmin sadhamāde ||
Translation: Indra, I call thee to our feast.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र इत सोमपा एक इन्द्रः सुतपा विश्वायुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra it somapā eka indraḥ sutapā viśvāyuḥ |
Translation: 4 Beloved of all, Indra alone drinks up the flowing Soma juice

Sanskit Text: अन्तर्देवान मर्त्यांश्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: antardevān martyāṃśca ||
Translation: Among the Gods and mortal men.

Sanskit Text: न यं शुक्रो न दुराशीर्न तर्प्रा उरुव्यचसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yaṃ śukro na durāśīrna tṛprā uruvyacasam |
Translation: 5 The Friend, whom not the brilliant-hued, the badly-mixt or bitter draught,

Sanskit Text: अपस्प्र्ण्वते सुहार्दम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apaspṛṇvate suhārdam ||
Translation: Repels, the far-extending God;

Sanskit Text: गोभिर्यदीमन्ये अस्मन मर्गं न वरा मर्गयन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghobhiryadīmanye asman mṛghaṃ na vrā mṛghayante |
Translation: 6 While other men than we with milk chase him as hunters chase a deer,

Sanskit Text: अभित्सरन्ति धेनुभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhitsaranti dhenubhiḥ ||
Translation: And with their kine inveigle him.

Sanskit Text: तरय इन्द्रस्य सोमाः सुतासः सन्तु देवस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: traya indrasya somāḥ sutāsaḥ santu devasya |
Translation: 7 For him, for Indra, for the God, be pressed three draughts of Soma juice

Sanskit Text: सवे कषये सुतपाव्नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sve kṣaye sutapāvnaḥ ||
Translation: In the juice-drinker's own abode.

Sanskit Text: तरयः कोशासः शचोतन्ति तिस्रश्चम्वः सुपूर्णाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trayaḥ kośāsaḥ ścotanti tisraścamvaḥ supūrṇāḥ |
Translation: 8 Three reservoirs exude their drops, filled are three beakers to the brim,

Sanskit Text: समाने अधि भार्मन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samāne adhi bhārman ||
Translation: All for one offering to the God.

Sanskit Text: शुचिरसि पुरुनिष्ठाः कषीरैर्मध्यत आशीर्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śucirasi puruniṣṭhāḥ kṣīrairmadhyata āśīrtaḥ |
Translation: 9 Pure art thou, set in many a place, and blended in the midst with milk

Sanskit Text: दध्ना मन्दिष्ठः शूरस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhnā mandiṣṭhaḥ śūrasya ||
Translation: And curd, to cheer the Hero best.

Sanskit Text: इमे त इन्द्र सोमास्तीव्रा अस्मे सुतासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime ta indra somāstīvrā asme sutāsaḥ |
Translation: 10 Here, Indra, are thy Soma-draughts pressed out by us, the strong, the pure:

Sanskit Text: शुक्रा आशिरंयाचन्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śukrā āśiraṃyācante ||
Translation: They crave admixture of the milk.

Sanskit Text: तानाशिरं पुरोळाशमिन्द्रेमं सोमं शरीणीहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tānāśiraṃ puroḷāśamindremaṃ somaṃ śrīṇīhi |
Translation: 11 O Indra, pour in milk, prepare the cake, and mix the Soma-draught.

Sanskit Text: रेवन्तं हि तवा शर्णोमि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: revantaṃ hi tvā śṛṇomi ||
Translation: I hear them say that thou art rich.

Sanskit Text: हर्त्सु पीतासो युध्यन्ते दुर्मदासो न सुरायाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hṛtsu pītāso yudhyante durmadāso na surāyām |
Translation: 12 Quaffed juices fight within the breast. The drunken praise not by their wine,

Sanskit Text: ऊधर्न नग्ना जरन्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūdharna naghnā jarante ||
Translation: The naked praise not when it rains.

Sanskit Text: रेवानिद रेवत सतोता सयात तवावतो मघोनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: revānid revata stotā syāt tvāvato maghonaḥ |
Translation: 13 Rich be the praiser of one rich, munificent and famed like thee:

Sanskit Text: परेदु हरिवः शरुतस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: predu harivaḥ śrutasya ||
Translation: High rank be his, O Lord of Bays.

Sanskit Text: उक्थं चन शस्यमानमगोररिरा चिकेत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukthaṃ cana śasyamānamaghorarirā ciketa |
Translation: 14 Foe of the man who adds no milk, he heeds not any chanted hymn

Sanskit Text: न गायत्रंगीयमानम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na ghāyatraṃghīyamānam ||
Translation: Or holy psalm that may he sung.

Sanskit Text: मा न इन्द्र पीयत्नवे मा शर्धते परा दाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā na indra pīyatnave mā śardhate parā dāḥ |
Translation: 15 Give us not, Indra, as a prey unto the scornful or the proud:

Sanskit Text: शिक्षा शचीवः शचीभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śikṣā śacīvaḥ śacībhiḥ ||
Translation: Help, Mighty One, with power and might.

Sanskit Text: वयमु तवा तदिदर्था इन्द्र तवायन्तः सखायः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayamu tvā tadidarthā indra tvāyantaḥ sakhāyaḥ |
Translation: 16 This, even this, O Indra, we implore. as thy devoted friends,

Sanskit Text: कण्वाुक्थेभिर्जरन्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaṇvāukthebhirjarante ||
Translation: The Kaṇvas praise thee with their hymns.

Sanskit Text: न घेमन्यदा पपन वज्रिन्नपसो नविष्टौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na ghemanyadā papana vajrinnapaso naviṣṭau |
Translation: 17 Naught else, O Thunderer, have I praised in the skilled singer's eulogy:

Sanskit Text: तवेदु सतोमं चिकेत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tavedu stomaṃ ciketa ||
Translation: On thy land only have I thought.

Sanskit Text: इछन्ति देवाः सुन्वन्तं न सवप्नाय सप्र्हयन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ichanti devāḥ sunvantaṃ na svapnāya spṛhayanti |
Translation: 18 The Gods seek him who presses out the Soma; they desire not sleep

Sanskit Text: यन्ति परमादमतन्द्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yanti pramādamatandrāḥ ||
Translation: They punish sloth unweariedly.

Sanskit Text: ओ षु पर याहि वाजेभिर्मा हर्णीथा अभ्यस्मान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: o ṣu pra yāhi vājebhirmā hṛṇīthā abhyasmān |
Translation: 19 Come hither swift with gifts of wealth - be not thou angry with us-like

Sanskit Text: महानिव युवजानिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahāniva yuvajāniḥ ||
Translation: A great man with a youthful bride.

Sanskit Text: मो षवद्य दुर्हणावान सायं करदारे अस्मत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mo ṣvadya durhaṇāvān sāyaṃ karadāre asmat |
Translation: 20 Let him not, wrathful with us, spend the evening far from us to-day,

Sanskit Text: अश्रीर इव जामाता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśrīra iva jāmātā ||
Translation: Like some unpleasant son-in-law.

Sanskit Text: विद्मा हयस्य वीरस्य भूरिदावरीं सुमतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidmā hyasya vīrasya bhūridāvarīṃ sumatim |
Translation: 21 For well we know this Hero's love, most liberal of the boons he gives,

Sanskit Text: तरिषु जातस्य मनांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: triṣu jātasya manāṃsi ||
Translation: His plans whom the three worlds display.

Sanskit Text: आ तू षिञ्च कण्वमन्तं न घा विद्म शवसानात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tū ṣiñca kaṇvamantaṃ na ghā vidma śavasānāt |
Translation: 22 Pour forth the gift which Kaṇvas bring, for none more glorious do we know

Sanskit Text: यशस्तरं शतमूतेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaśastaraṃ śatamūteḥ ||
Translation: Than the Strong Lord with countless aids.

Sanskit Text: जयेष्ठेन सोतरिन्द्राय सोमं वीराय शक्राय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyeṣṭhena sotarindrāya somaṃ vīrāya śakrāya |
Translation: 23 O presser, offer Soma first to Indra, Hero, Śakra, him

Sanskit Text: भरा पिबन नर्याय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharā piban naryāya ||
Translation: The Friend of man, that he may drink;

Sanskit Text: यो वेदिष्ठो अव्यथिष्वश्वावन्तं जरित्र्भ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vediṣṭho avyathiṣvaśvāvantaṃ jaritṛbhyaḥ |
Translation: 24 Who, in untroubled ways, is best provider, for his worshippers.

Sanskit Text: वाजं सतोत्र्भ्यो गोमन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājaṃ stotṛbhyo ghomantam ||
Translation: Of strength in horses and in kine.

Sanskit Text: पन्यम-पन्यमित सोतार आ धावत मद्याय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: panyam-panyamit sotāra ā dhāvata madyāya |
Translation: 25 Pressers, for him blend Soma juice, each draught most excellent, for him

Sanskit Text: सोमं वीरय शूरय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaṃ vīraya śūraya ||
Translation: The Brave, the Hero, for his joy.

Sanskit Text: पाता वर्त्रहा सुतमा घा गमन नारे अस्मत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pātā vṛtrahā sutamā ghā ghaman nāre asmat |
Translation: 26 The Vṛtra-slayer drinks the juice. May he who gives a hundred aids

Sanskit Text: नि यमते शतमूतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni yamate śatamūtiḥ ||
Translation: Approach, nor stay afar from us.

Sanskit Text: एह हरी बरह्मयुजा शग्मा वक्षतः सखायम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eha harī brahmayujā śaghmā vakṣataḥ sakhāyam |
Translation: 27 May the strong Bay Steeds, yoked by prayer, bring hither unto us our Friend,

Sanskit Text: गीर्भिःश्रुतं गिर्वणसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghīrbhiḥśrutaṃ ghirvaṇasam ||
Translation: Lover of Song, renowned by songs.

Sanskit Text: सवादवः सोमा आ याहि शरीताः सोमा आ याहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svādavaḥ somā ā yāhi śrītāḥ somā ā yāhi |
Translation: 28 Sweet are the Soma juices, come! Blent are the Soma juices, come!

Sanskit Text: शिप्रिन्न्र्षीवः शचीवो नायमछा सधमादम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śiprinnṛṣīvaḥ śacīvo nāyamachā sadhamādam ||
Translation: Ṛṣi-like, mighty, fair of cheek, come hither quickly to the feast.

Sanskit Text: सतुतश्च यास्त्वा वर्धन्ति महे राधसे नर्म्णाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stutaśca yāstvā vardhanti mahe rādhase nṛmṇāya |
Translation: 29 And lauds which strengthen thee for great bounty and valour, and exalt

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रकारिणं वर्धन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrakāriṇaṃ vṛdhantaḥ ||
Translation: Indra who doeth glorious deeds,

Sanskit Text: गिरश्च यास्ते गिर्वाह उक्था च तुभ्यं तानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghiraśca yāste ghirvāha ukthā ca tubhyaṃ tāni |
Translation: 30 And songs to thee who lovest song, and all those hymns addressed to thee-

Sanskit Text: सत्रा दधिरे शवांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satrā dadhire śavāṃsi ||
Translation: These evermore confirm thy might.

Sanskit Text: एवेदेष तुविकूर्मिर्वाजानेको वज्रहस्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evedeṣa tuvikūrmirvājāneko vajrahastaḥ |
Translation: 31 Thus he, sole doer of great deeds whose hand holds thunder, gives us strength,

Sanskit Text: सनदम्र्क्तोदयते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanadamṛktodayate ||
Translation: He who hath never been subdued.

Sanskit Text: हन्त वर्त्रं दक्षिणेनेन्द्रः पुरु पुरुहूतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hanta vṛtraṃ dakṣiṇenendraḥ puru puruhūtaḥ |
Translation: 32 Vṛtra he slays with his right hand, even Indra, great with mighty power,

Sanskit Text: महान महीभिः शचिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahān mahībhiḥ śacibhiḥ ||
Translation: And much-invoked in many a place.

Sanskit Text: यस्मिन विश्वाश्चर्षणय उत चयौत्ना जरयांसि च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasmin viśvāścarṣaṇaya uta cyautnā jrayāṃsi ca |
Translation: 33 He upon whom all men depend, all regions, all achievements, he

Sanskit Text: अनु घेन मन्दी मघोनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu ghen mandī maghonaḥ ||
Translation: Takes pleasure in our wealthy chiefs.

Sanskit Text: एष एतानि चकारेन्द्रो विश्वा यो.अति शर्ण्वे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa etāni cakārendro viśvā yo.ati śṛṇve |
Translation: 34 All this hath he accomplished, yea, Indra, most gloriously renowned,

Sanskit Text: वाजदावा मघोनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājadāvā maghonām ||
Translation: Who gives our wealthy princes strength.

Sanskit Text: परभर्ता रथं गव्यन्तमपाकच्चिद यमवति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prabhartā rathaṃ ghavyantamapākaccid yamavati |
Translation: 35 Who drives his chariot seeking spoil, from afar, to him he loves:

Sanskit Text: इनो वसुस हि वोळ्हा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ino vasusa hi voḷhā ||
Translation: For swift is he to bring men wealth.

Sanskit Text: सनिता विप्रो अर्वद्भिर्हन्ता वर्त्रं नर्भिः शूरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanitā vipro arvadbhirhantā vṛtraṃ nṛbhiḥ śūraḥ |
Translation: 36 The Sage who, winning spoil with steeds, slays Vṛtra, Hero with the men,

Sanskit Text: सत्यो.अविता विधन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satyo.avitā vidhantam ||
Translation: His servant's faithful succourer.

Sanskit Text: यजध्वैनं परियमेधा इन्द्रं सत्राचा मनसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajadhvainaṃ priyamedhā indraṃ satrācā manasā |
Translation: 37 O Priyamedhas, worship with collected mind this Indra whom

Sanskit Text: यो भूत सोमैः सत्यमद्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo bhūt somaiḥ satyamadvā ||
Translation: The Soma hath full well inspired.

Sanskit Text: गाथश्रवसं सत्पतिं शरवस्कामं पुरुत्मानम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāthaśravasaṃ satpatiṃ śravaskāmaṃ purutmānam |
Translation: 38 Ye Kaṇvas, sing the Mighty One, Lord of the Brave, who loves renown,

Sanskit Text: कण्वासोगात वाजिनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaṇvāsoghāta vājinam ||
Translation: All-present, glorified by song.

Sanskit Text: य रते चिद गास पदेभ्यो दात सखा नर्भ्यः शचीवान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya ṛte cid ghās padebhyo dāt sakhā nṛbhyaḥ śacīvān |
Translation: 39 Strong Friend, who, with no trace of feet, restores the cattle to the men,

Sanskit Text: येस्मिन काममश्रियन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yeasmin kāmamaśriyan ||
Translation: Who rest their wish and hope on him.

Sanskit Text: इत्था धीवन्तमद्रिवः काण्वं मेध्यातिथिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: itthā dhīvantamadrivaḥ kāṇvaṃ medhyātithim |
Translation: 40 Shaped as a Ram, Stone-hurler I once thou camest hither to the son

Sanskit Text: मेषो भूतोऽभि यन्नयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: meṣo bhūto'bhi yannayaḥ ||
Translation: Of Kaṇva, wise Medhyātithi.

Sanskit Text: शिक्षा विभिन्दो अस्मै चत्वार्ययुता ददत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śikṣā vibhindo asmai catvāryayutā dadat |
Translation: 41 Vibhindu, thou hast helped this man, giving him thousands four times ten,

Sanskit Text: अष्टा परः सहस्रा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṣṭā paraḥ sahasrā ||
Translation: And afterward eight thousand more.

Sanskit Text: उत सु तये पयोव्र्धा माकी रणस्य नप्त्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta su tye payovṛdhā mākī raṇasya naptyā |
Translation: 42 And these twain pouring streams of milk, creative, daughters of delight,

Sanskit Text: जनित्वनाय मामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: janitvanāya māmahe ||
Translation: For wedlock sake I glorify.

Sanskit Text: पिबा सुतस्य रसिनो मत्स्वा न इन्द्र गोमतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibā sutasya rasino matsvā na indra ghomataḥ |
Translation: 1. DRINK, Indra, of the savoury juice, and cheer thee with our milky draught.

Sanskit Text: आपिर्नो बोधिसधमाद्यो वर्धे.अस्मानवन्तु ते धियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpirno bodhisadhamādyo vṛdhe.asmānavantu te dhiyaḥ ||
Translation: Be, for our weal, our Friend and sharer of the feast, and let thy wisdom guard us well.

Sanskit Text: भूयाम ते सुमतौ वाजिनो वयं मा न सतरभिमातये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūyāma te sumatau vājino vayaṃ mā na starabhimātaye |
Translation: 2 In thy kind grace and favour may we still be strong: expose us not to foe's attack.

Sanskit Text: अस्माञ्चित्राभिरवतादभिष्टिभिरा नः सुम्नेषु यामय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmāñcitrābhiravatādabhiṣṭibhirā naḥ sumneṣu yāmaya ||
Translation: With manifold assistance guard and succour us, and bring us to felicity.

Sanskit Text: इमा उ तवा पुरूवसो गिरो वर्धन्तु या मम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā u tvā purūvaso ghiro vardhantu yā mama |
Translation: 3 May these my songs of praise exalt thee, Lord, who hast abundant wealth.

Sanskit Text: पावकवर्णाःशुचयो विपश्चितो.अभि सतोमैरनूषत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāvakavarṇāḥśucayo vipaścito.abhi stomairanūṣata ||
Translation: Men skilled in holy hymns, pure, with the hues of fire, have sung them with their lauds to thee.

Sanskit Text: अयं सहस्रं रषिभिः सहस्क्र्तः समुद्र इव पप्रथे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ sahasraṃ ṛṣibhiḥ sahaskṛtaḥ samudra iva paprathe |
Translation: 4 He, with his might enhanced by Ṛṣis thousandfold, hath like an ocean spread himself.

Sanskit Text: सत्यः सो अस्य महिमा गर्णे शवो यज्ञेषु विप्रराज्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satyaḥ so asya mahimā ghṛṇe śavo yajñeṣu viprarājye ||
Translation: His majesty is praised as true at solemn rites, his power where holy singers rule.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रमिद देवतातय इन्द्रं परयत्यध्वरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indramid devatātaya indraṃ prayatyadhvare |
Translation: 5 Indra for worship of the Gods, Indra while sacrifice proceeds,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं समीकेवनिनो हवामह इन्द्रं धनस्य सातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ samīkevanino havāmaha indraṃ dhanasya sātaye ||
Translation: Indra, as worshippers in battle-shock, we call, Indra that we may win the spoil.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो मह्ना रोदसी पप्रथच्छव इन्द्रः सूर्यमरोचयत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro mahnā rodasī paprathacchava indraḥ sūryamarocayat |
Translation: 6 With might hath Indra spread out heaven and earth, with power hath Indra lighted up the Sun.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रे ह विश्वा भुवनानि येमिर इन्द्रे सुवानास इन्दवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indre ha viśvā bhuvanāni yemira indre suvānāsa indavaḥ ||
Translation: In Indra are all creatures closely held; in him meet the distilling Soma-drops.

Sanskit Text: अभि तवा पूर्वपीतय इन्द्र सतोमेभिरायवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tvā pūrvapītaya indra stomebhirāyavaḥ |
Translation: 7 Men with their lauds are urging thee, Indra, to drink the Soma first.

Sanskit Text: समीचीनासर्भवः समस्वरन रुद्रा गर्नन्त पूर्व्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samīcīnāsaṛbhavaḥ samasvaran rudrā ghṛnanta pūrvyam ||
Translation: The Ṛbhus in accord have lifted up their voice, and Rudras sung thee as the first.

Sanskit Text: अस्येदिन्द्रो वाव्र्धे वर्ष्ण्यं शवो मदे सुतस्य विष्णवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asyedindro vāvṛdhe vṛṣṇyaṃ śavo made sutasya viṣṇavi |
Translation: 8 Indra increased his manly strength at sacrifice, in the wild rapture of this juice.

Sanskit Text: अद्या तमस्य महिमानमायवो.अनु षटुवन्ति पूर्वथा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adyā tamasya mahimānamāyavo.anu ṣṭuvanti pūrvathā ||
Translation: And living men to-day, even as of old, sing forth their praises to his majesty.

Sanskit Text: तत तवा यामि सुवीर्यं तद बरह्म पूर्वचित्तये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat tvā yāmi suvīryaṃ tad brahma pūrvacittaye |
Translation: 9 I crave of thee that hero strength, that thou mayst first regard this prayer,

Sanskit Text: येना यतिभ्यो भर्गवे धने हिते येन परस्कण्वमाविथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenā yatibhyo bhṛghave dhane hite yena praskaṇvamāvitha ||
Translation: Wherewith thou holpest Bhṛgu and the Yatis and Praskaṇva when the prize was staked.

Sanskit Text: येना समुद्रमस्र्जो महीरपस्तदिन्द्र वर्ष्णि ते शवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenā samudramasṛjo mahīrapastadindra vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ |
Translation: 10 Wherewith thou sentest mighty waters to the sea, that, Indra, is thy manly strength.

Sanskit Text: सद्यः सो अस्य महिमा न संनशे यं कषोणीरनुचक्रदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadyaḥ so asya mahimā na saṃnaśe yaṃ kṣoṇīranucakrade ||
Translation: For ever unattainable is this power of him to whom the worlds have cried aloud.

Sanskit Text: शग्धी न इन्द्र यत तवा रयिं यामि सुवीर्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaghdhī na indra yat tvā rayiṃ yāmi suvīryam |
Translation: 11 Help us, O Indra, when we pray to thee for wealth and hero might.

Sanskit Text: शग्धि वाजाय परथमं सिषासते शग्धि सतोमाय पूर्व्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaghdhi vājāya prathamaṃ siṣāsate śaghdhi stomāya pūrvya ||
Translation: First help thou on to strength the man who strives to win, and aid our laud, O Ancient One.

Sanskit Text: शग्धी नो अस्य यद ध पौरमाविथ धिय इन्द्र सिषासतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaghdhī no asya yad dha pauramāvitha dhiya indra siṣāsataḥ |
Translation: 12 Help for us, Indra, as thou holpest Paura once, this man's devotions bent on gain.

Sanskit Text: शग्धि यथा रुशमं शयावकं कर्पमिन्द्र परावः सवर्णरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaghdhi yathā ruśamaṃ śyāvakaṃ kṛpamindra prāvaḥ svarṇaram ||
Translation: Help, as thou gavest Ruśama and Śyāvaka and Svarṇara and Kṛpa aid.

Sanskit Text: कन नव्यो अतसीनां तुरो गर्णीत मर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kan navyo atasīnāṃ turo ghṛṇīta martyaḥ |
Translation: 13 What newest of imploring prayers shall, then, the zealous mortal sing?

Sanskit Text: नही नवस्य महिमानमिन्द्रियं सवर्ग्र्णन्त आनशुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahī nvasya mahimānamindriyaṃ svarghṛṇanta ānaśuḥ ||
Translation: For have not they who laud his might, and Indra-power won for themselves the light of heaven?

Sanskit Text: कदु सतुवन्त रतयन्त देवत रषिः को विप्र ओहते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadu stuvanta ṛtayanta devata ṛṣiḥ ko vipra ohate |
Translation: 14 When shall they keep the Law and praise thee mid the Gods? Who counts as Ṛṣi and as sage?

Sanskit Text: कदा हवं मघवन्निन्द्र सुन्वतः कदु सतुवत आ गमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadā havaṃ maghavannindra sunvataḥ kadu stuvata ā ghamaḥ ||
Translation: When ever wilt thou, Indra Maghavan, come nigh to presser's or to praiser's call?

Sanskit Text: उदु तये मधुमत्तमा गिर सतोमास ईरते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udu tye madhumattamā ghira stomāsa īrate |
Translation: 15 These songs of ours exceeding sweet, these hymns of praise ascend to thee,

Sanskit Text: सत्राजितो धनसा अक्षितोतयो वाजयन्तो रथा इव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satrājito dhanasā akṣitotayo vājayanto rathā iva ||
Translation: Like ever-conquering chariots that display their strength, gain wealth, and give unfailing aid.

Sanskit Text: कण्वा इव भर्गवः सूर्या इव विश्वमिद धीतमानशुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaṇvā iva bhṛghavaḥ sūryā iva viśvamid dhītamānaśuḥ |
Translation: 16 The Bhṛgus are like Suns, like Kaṇvas, and have gained all that their thoughts were bent upon.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं सतोमेभिर्महयन्त आयवः परियमेधासो अस्वरन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ stomebhirmahayanta āyavaḥ priyamedhāso asvaran ||
Translation: The living men of Priyamedha's race have sung exalting Indra with their lauds.

Sanskit Text: युक्ष्वा हि वर्त्रहन्तम हरी इन्द्र परावतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yukṣvā hi vṛtrahantama harī indra parāvataḥ |
Translation: 17 Best slayer of the Vṛtras, yoke thy Bay Steeds, Indra, from afar.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाचीनो मघवन सोमपीतय उग्र रष्वेभिरा गहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvācīno maghavan somapītaya ughra ṛṣvebhirā ghahi ||
Translation: Come with the High Ones hither, Maghavan, to us, Mighty, to drink the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: इमे हि ते कारवो वावशुर्धिया विप्रासो मेधसातये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime hi te kāravo vāvaśurdhiyā viprāso medhasātaye |
Translation: 18 For these, the bards and singers, have cried out to thee with prayer, to gain the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: सत्वं नो मघवन्निन्द्र गिर्वणो वेनो न शर्णुधी हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satvaṃ no maghavannindra ghirvaṇo veno na śṛṇudhī havam ||
Translation: As such, O Maghavan, Indra, who lovest song, even as a lover bear my call.

Sanskit Text: निरिन्द्र बर्हतीभ्यो वर्त्रं धनुभ्यो अस्फुरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nirindra bṛhatībhyo vṛtraṃ dhanubhyo asphuraḥ |
Translation: 19 Thou from the lofty plains above, O Indra, hurledst Vṛtra down.

Sanskit Text: निरर्बुदस्य मर्गयस्य मायिनो निः पर्वतस्य गा आजः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nirarbudasya mṛghayasya māyino niḥ parvatasya ghā ājaḥ ||
Translation: Thou dravest forth the kine of guileful Mṛgaya and Arbuda from the mountain's hold.

Sanskit Text: निरग्नयो रुरुचुर्निरु सूर्यो निः सोम इन्द्रियो रसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: niraghnayo rurucurniru sūryo niḥ soma indriyo rasaḥ |
Translation: 20 Bright were the flaming fires, the Sun gave forth his shine, and Soma, Indra's juice, shone clear.

Sanskit Text: निरन्तरिक्षादधमो महामहिं कर्षे तदिन्द्र पौंस्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nirantarikṣādadhamo mahāmahiṃ kṛṣe tadindra pauṃsyam ||
Translation: Indra, thou blewest the great Dragon from the air: men must regard that valorous deed.

Sanskit Text: यं मे दुरिन्द्रो मरुतः पाकस्थामा कौरयाणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ me durindro marutaḥ pākasthāmā kaurayāṇaḥ |
Translation: 21 The fairest courser of them all, who runneth on as ’twere to heaven.

Sanskit Text: विश्वेषां तमना शोभिष्ठमुपेव दिवि धावमानम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśveṣāṃ tmanā śobhiṣṭhamupeva divi dhāvamānam ||
Translation: Which Indra and the Maruts gave, and Pākasthāman Kaurayāṇ.

Sanskit Text: रोहितं मे पाकस्थामा सुधुरं कक्ष्यप्राम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rohitaṃ me pākasthāmā sudhuraṃ kakṣyaprām |
Translation: 22 To me hath Pākasthāman given, a ruddy horse, good at the pole,

Sanskit Text: अदाद रायो विबोधनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adād rāyo vibodhanam ||
Translation: Filling is girth and rousing wealth;

Sanskit Text: यस्मा अन्ये दश परति धुरं वहन्ति वह्नयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasmā anye daśa prati dhuraṃ vahanti vahnayaḥ |
Translation: 23 Compared with whom no other ten strong coursers, harnessed to the pole,

Sanskit Text: अस्तं वयो न तुग्र्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: astaṃ vayo na tughryam ||
Translation: Bear Tugrya to his dwelling place.

Sanskit Text: आत्मा पितुस्तनूर्वास ओजोदा अभ्यञ्जनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ātmā pitustanūrvāsa ojodā abhyañjanam |
Translation: 24 Raiment is body, food is life, and healing ointment giveth strength.

Sanskit Text: तुरीयमिद रोहितस्य पाकस्थामानं भोजं दातारमब्रवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: turīyamid rohitasya pākasthāmānaṃ bhojaṃ dātāramabravam ||
Translation: As the free-handed giver of the ruddy steed, I have named Pākasthāman fourth.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्र परागपागुदं नयग वा हूयसे नर्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindra prāghapāghudaṃ nyagh vā hūyase nṛbhiḥ |
Translation: 1. THOUGH, Indra, thou art called by men eastward and westward, north and south,

Sanskit Text: सिमा पुरू नर्षूतो अस्यानवे.असि परशर्ध तुर्वशे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: simā purū nṛṣūto asyānave.asi praśardha turvaśe ||
Translation: Thou chiefly art with Ānava and Turvaśa, brave Champion I urged by men to Come.

Sanskit Text: यद वा रुमे रुशमे शयावके कर्प इन्द्र मादयसे सचा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā rume ruśame śyāvake kṛpa indra mādayase sacā |
Translation: 2 Or, Indra, when with Ruma, Ruśama, Śyāvaka, and Kṛpa thou rejoicest thee,

Sanskit Text: कण्वासस्त्वा बरह्मभि सतोमवाहस इन्द्रा यछन्त्या गहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaṇvāsastvā brahmabhi stomavāhasa indrā yachantyā ghahi ||
Translation: Still do the Kaṇvas, bringing praises, with their prayers, O Indra, draw thee hither: come.

Sanskit Text: यथा गौरो अपा कर्तं तर्ष्यन्नेत्यवेरिणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā ghauro apā kṛtaṃ tṛṣyannetyaveriṇam |
Translation: 3 Even as the wild-bull, when he thirsts, goes to the desert's watery pool,

Sanskit Text: आपित्वे नः परपित्वे तूयमा गहि कण्वेषु सु सचा पिब ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpitve naḥ prapitve tūyamā ghahi kaṇveṣu su sacā piba ||
Translation: Come hither quickly both at morning and at eve, and with the Kaṇvas drink thy fill.

Sanskit Text: मन्दन्तु तवा मघवन्निन्द्रेन्दवो राधोदेयाय सुन्वते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mandantu tvā maghavannindrendavo rādhodeyāya sunvate |
Translation: 4 May the drops gladden thee, rich Indra, and obtain bounty for him who pours the juice.

Sanskit Text: आमुष्या सोममपिबश्चमू सुतं जयेष्ठं तद दधिषे सहः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āmuṣyā somamapibaścamū sutaṃ jyeṣṭhaṃ tad dadhiṣe sahaḥ ||
Translation: Soma pressed in the mortar didst thou take and drink, and hence hast won surpassing might.

Sanskit Text: पर चक्रे सहसा सहो बभञ्ज मन्युमोजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra cakre sahasā saho babhañja manyumojasā |
Translation: 5 With mightier strength he conquered strength, with energy he crushed their wrath.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे त इन्द्र पर्तनायवो यहो नि वर्क्षा इव येमिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve ta indra pṛtanāyavo yaho ni vṛkṣā iva yemire ||
Translation: O Indra, Strong in youth, all those who sought the fray bent and bowed down to thee like trees.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रेणेव सचते यवीयुधा यस्त आनळ उपस्तुतिं पुत्रं परावर्गं कर्णुते सुवीर्ये दाश्नोति नमौक्तिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasreṇeva sacate yavīyudhā yasta ānaḷ upastutiṃ putraṃ prāvarghaṃ kṛṇute suvīrye dāśnoti namauktibhiḥ ||
Translation: 6 He who wins promise of thine aid goes girt as with a thousand mighty men of war.

Sanskit Text: मा भेम मा शरमिष्मोग्रस्य सख्ये तव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā bhema mā śramiṣmoghrasya sakhye tava |
Translation: He makes his son preeminent in hero might: he serves with reverential prayer.

Sanskit Text: महत ते वर्ष्णो अभिचक्ष्यं कर्तं पश्येम तुर्वशं यदुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahat te vṛṣṇo abhicakṣyaṃ kṛtaṃ paśyema turvaśaṃ yadum ||
Translation: 7 With thee, the Mighty, for our Friend, we will not fear or feel fatigue.

Sanskit Text: सव्यामनु सफिग्यं वावसे वर्षा न दानो अस्य रोषति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: savyāmanu sphighyaṃ vāvase vṛṣā na dāno asya roṣati |
Translation: May we see Turvaśa and Yadu: thy great deed, O Hero, must be glorified.

Sanskit Text: मध्वा सम्प्र्क्ताः सारघेण धेनवस्तूयमेहि दरवा पिब ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhvā sampṛktāḥ sāragheṇa dhenavastūyamehi dravā piba ||
Translation: 8 On his left hip the Hero hath reclined himself: the proffered feast offends him not.

Sanskit Text: अश्वी रथी सुरूप इद गोमानिदिन्द्र ते सखा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvī rathī surūpa id ghomānidindra te sakhā |
Translation: The milk is blended with the honey of the bee: quickly come hither, baste, and drink.

Sanskit Text: शवात्रभजा वयसा सचते सदा चन्द्रो याति सभामुप ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śvātrabhajā vayasā sacate sadā candro yāti sabhāmupa ||
Translation: 9 Indra, thy friend is fair of form and rich in horses, cars, and kine.

Sanskit Text: रश्यो न तर्ष्यन्नवपानमा गहि पिबा सोमं वशाननु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛśyo na tṛṣyannavapānamā ghahi pibā somaṃ vaśānanu |
Translation: He evermore hath food accompanied by wealth, and radiant joins the company.

Sanskit Text: निमेघमानो मघवन दिवे-दिव ओजिष्ठं दधिषे सहः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nimeghamāno maghavan dive-diva ojiṣṭhaṃ dadhiṣe sahaḥ ||
Translation: 10 Come like a thirsty antelope to the drinking-place: drink Soma to thy heart's desire.

Sanskit Text: अध्वर्यो दरावया तवं सोममिन्द्रः पिपासति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhvaryo drāvayā tvaṃ somamindraḥ pipāsati |
Translation: Raining it down, O Maghavan, day after day, thou gainest thy surpassing might.

Sanskit Text: उप नूनंयुयुजे वर्षणा हरी आ च जगाम वर्त्रहा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa nūnaṃyuyuje vṛṣaṇā harī ā ca jaghāma vṛtrahā ||
Translation: 11 Priest, let the Soma juice flow forth, for Indra longs to drink thereof.

Sanskit Text: सवयं चित स मन्यते दाशुरिर्जनो यत्रा सोमस्य तर्म्पसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svayaṃ cit sa manyate dāśurirjano yatrā somasya tṛmpasi |
Translation: He even now hath yoked his vigorous Bay Steeds: the Vṛtra-slayer hath come near.

Sanskit Text: इदं ते अन्नं युज्यं समुक्षितं तस्येहि पर दरवा पिब ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ te annaṃ yujyaṃ samukṣitaṃ tasyehi pra dravā piba ||
Translation: 12 The man with whom thou fillcst thee with Soma deems himself a pious worshipper.

Sanskit Text: रथेष्ठायाध्वर्यवः सोममिन्द्राय सोतन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ratheṣṭhāyādhvaryavaḥ somamindrāya sotana |
Translation: This thine appropriate food is here poured out for thee: come, hasten forward. drink of it,

Sanskit Text: अधि बरध्नस्याद्रयो वि चक्षते सुन्वन्तो दाश्वध्वरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi bradhnasyādrayo vi cakṣate sunvanto dāśvadhvaram ||
Translation: 13 Press out the Soma juice, ye priests, for Indra borne upon his car.

Sanskit Text: उप बरध्नं वावाता वर्षणा हरी इन्द्रमपसु वक्षतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa bradhnaṃ vāvātā vṛṣaṇā harī indramapasu vakṣataḥ |
Translation: The pressing-stones speak loud of Indra, while they shed the juice which, offered, honours him.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाञ्चं तवा सप्तयो.अध्वरश्रियो वहन्तु सवनेदुप ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāñcaṃ tvā saptayo.adhvaraśriyo vahantu savanedupa ||
Translation: 14 To the brown juice may his dear vigorous Bay Steeds bring Indra, to our holy task.

Sanskit Text: पर पूषणं वर्णीमहे युज्याय पुरूवसुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra pūṣaṇaṃ vṛṇīmahe yujyāya purūvasum |
Translation: Hither let thy Car-steeds who seek the sacrifice bring thee to our drink-offerings.

Sanskit Text: स शक्र शिक्ष पुरुहूत नो धिया तुजे राये विमोचन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa śakra śikṣa puruhūta no dhiyā tuje rāye vimocana ||
Translation: 15 Pūṣan, the Lord of ample wealth, for firm alliance we elect.

Sanskit Text: सं नः शिशीहि भुरिजोरिव कषुरं रास्व रायो विमोचन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ naḥ śiśīhi bhurijoriva kṣuraṃ rāsva rāyo vimocana |
Translation: May he with wisdom, Śakra! Looser! Much-invoked! aid us to riches and to seed.

Sanskit Text: तवे तन नः सुवेदमुस्रियं वसु यं तवं हिनोषि मर्त्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve tan naḥ suvedamusriyaṃ vasu yaṃ tvaṃ hinoṣi martyam ||
Translation: 16 Sharpen us like a razor in the barber's hands: send riches thou who settest free.

Sanskit Text: वेमि तवा पूषन्न्र्ञ्जसे वेमि सतोतव आघ्र्णे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vemi tvā pūṣannṛñjase vemi stotava āghṛṇe |
Translation: Easy to find with thee are treasures of the Dawn for mortal man whom thou dost speed.

Sanskit Text: न तस्य वेम्यरणं हि तद वसो सतुषे पज्राय साम्ने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na tasya vemyaraṇaṃ hi tad vaso stuṣe pajrāya sāmne ||
Translation: 17 Pūṣan, I long to win thy love, I long to praise thee, Radiant God.

Sanskit Text: परा गावो यवसं कच्चिदाघ्र्णे नित्यं रेक्णो अमर्त्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parā ghāvo yavasaṃ kaccidāghṛṇe nityaṃ rekṇo amartya |
Translation: Excellent Lord, ’tis strange tome, no wish have I to sing the psalm that Pajra sings.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकं पूषन्नविता शिवो भव मंहिष्ठो वाजसातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākaṃ pūṣannavitā śivo bhava maṃhiṣṭho vājasātaye ||
Translation: 18 My kine, O Radiant God, seek pasture where they will, my during wealth, Immortal One.

Sanskit Text: सथूरं राधः शताश्वं कुरुङगस्य दिविष्टिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sthūraṃ rādhaḥ śatāśvaṃ kuruṅghasya diviṣṭiṣu |
Translation: Be our protector, Pūṣan! be, most liberal Lord, propitious to our gathering strength.

Sanskit Text: राज्ञस्त्वेषस्य सुभगस्य रातिषु तुर्वशेष्वमन्महि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājñastveṣasya subhaghasya rātiṣu turvaśeṣvamanmahi ||
Translation: 19 Rich was the gift Kurunga gave, a hundred steeds at morning rites.

Sanskit Text: धीभिः सातानि काण्वस्य वाजिनः परियमेधैरभिद्युभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhībhiḥ sātāni kāṇvasya vājinaḥ priyamedhairabhidyubhiḥ |
Translation: Among the gifts of Turvaśas we thought of him, the opulent, the splendid King.

Sanskit Text: षष्टिं सहस्रानु निर्मजामजे निर्यूथानि गवां रषिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrānu nirmajāmaje niryūthāni ghavāṃ ṛṣiḥ ||
Translation: 20 What by his morning songs Kaṇva, the powerful, hath, with the Priyamedhas, gained-

Sanskit Text: वर्क्षाश्चिन मे अभिपित्वे अरारणुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛkṣāścin me abhipitve arāraṇuḥ |
Translation: 71 The herds of sixty thousand pure and spotless kine, have I, the Ṛṣi, driven away.

Sanskit Text: गां भजन्त मेहनाश्वं भजन्त मेहन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāṃ bhajanta mehanāśvaṃ bhajanta mehana ||
Translation: 21 The very trees were joyful at my coming: kine they obtained in plenty, steeds in plenty.

Sanskit Text: दूरादिहेव यत सत्यरुणप्सुरशिश्वितत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūrādiheva yat satyaruṇapsuraśiśvitat |
Translation: 1. WHEN, even as she were present here, red Dawn hath shone from far away,

Sanskit Text: वि भानुं विश्वधातनत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi bhānuṃ viśvadhātanat ||
Translation: She spreadeth light on every side.

Sanskit Text: नर्वद दस्रा मनोयुजा रथेन पर्थुपाजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛvad dasrā manoyujā rathena pṛthupājasā |
Translation: 2 Like Heroes on your will-yoked car farshining, Wonder-Workers! ye

Sanskit Text: सचेथे अश्विनोषसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sacethe aśvinoṣasam ||
Translation: Attend, O Aśvins, on the Dawn.

Sanskit Text: युवाभ्यां वाजिनीवसू परति सतोम अद्र्क्षत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvābhyāṃ vājinīvasū prati stoma adṛkṣata |
Translation: 3 By you, O Lords of ample wealth our songs of praise have been observed:

Sanskit Text: वाचं दूतोयथोहिषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vācaṃ dūtoyathohiṣe ||
Translation: As envoy have I brought the prayer.

Sanskit Text: पुरुप्रिया ण ऊतये पुरुमन्द्रा पुरूवसू |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purupriyā ṇa ūtaye purumandrā purūvasū |
Translation: 4 Kaṇvas must praise the Aśvins dear to many, making many glad,

Sanskit Text: सतुषे कण्वासोश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stuṣe kaṇvāsoaśvinā ||
Translation: Most rich, that they may succour us.

Sanskit Text: मंहिष्ठा वाजसातमेषयन्ता शुभस पती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: maṃhiṣṭhā vājasātameṣayantā śubhas patī |
Translation: 5 Most liberal, best at winning strength, inciters, Lords of splendour who

Sanskit Text: गन्तारा दाशुषो गर्हम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghantārā dāśuṣo ghṛham ||
Translation: Visit the worshipper's abode.

Sanskit Text: ता सुदेवाय दाशुषे सुमेधामवितारिणीम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā sudevāya dāśuṣe sumedhāmavitāriṇīm |
Translation: 6 So for devout Sudeva dew with fatness his unfailing mead,

Sanskit Text: घर्तैर्गव्यूतिमुक्षतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtairghavyūtimukṣatam ||
Translation: And make it rich for sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: आ न सतोममुप दरवत तूयं शयेनेभिराशुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā na stomamupa dravat tūyaṃ śyenebhirāśubhiḥ |
Translation: 7 Hitherward running speedily with horses, as with rapid hawks,

Sanskit Text: यातमश्वेभिरश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yātamaśvebhiraśvinā ||
Translation: Come, Aśvins, to our song of praise

Sanskit Text: येभिस्तिस्रः परावतो दिवो विश्वानि रोचना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yebhistisraḥ parāvato divo viśvāni rocanā |
Translation: 8 Wherewith the three wide distances, and all the lights that are in heaven.

Sanskit Text: तरीन्रक्तून परिदीयथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trīnraktūn paridīyathaḥ ||
Translation: Ye traverse, and three times of night.

Sanskit Text: उत नो गोमतीरिष उत सातीरहर्विदा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta no ghomatīriṣa uta sātīraharvidā |
Translation: 9 O Finders of the Day, that we may win us food of kine and wealth,

Sanskit Text: वि पथः सातये सितम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi pathaḥ sātaye sitam ||
Translation: Open the paths for us to tread.

Sanskit Text: आ नो गोमन्तमश्विना सुवीरं सुरथं रयिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no ghomantamaśvinā suvīraṃ surathaṃ rayim |
Translation: 10 O Aśvins, bring us wealth in kine, in noble heroes, and in cars:

Sanskit Text: वोळ्हमश्वावतीरिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: voḷhamaśvāvatīriṣaḥ ||
Translation: Bring us the strength that horses give.

Sanskit Text: वाव्र्धाना शुभस पती दस्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāvṛdhānā śubhas patī dasrā hiraṇyavartanī |
Translation: 11 Ye Lords of splendour, glorified, ye Wonder-Workers borne on paths

Sanskit Text: पिबतं सोम्यं मधु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibataṃ somyaṃ madhu ||
Translation: Of gold, drink sweets with Somajuice.

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं वाजिनीवसू मघवद्भ्यश्च सप्रथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ vājinīvasū maghavadbhyaśca saprathaḥ |
Translation: 12 To us, ye Lords of ample wealth, and to our wealth chiefs extend

Sanskit Text: छर्दिर्यन्तमदाभ्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: chardiryantamadābhyam ||
Translation: Wide shelter, ne’er to be assailed.

Sanskit Text: नि षु बरह्म जनानां याविष्टं तूयमा गतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni ṣu brahma janānāṃ yāviṣṭaṃ tūyamā ghatam |
Translation: 13 Come quickly downward to the prayer of people whom ye favour most:

Sanskit Text: मो षवन्यानुपारतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mo ṣvanyānupāratam ||
Translation: Approach not unto other folk.

Sanskit Text: अस्य पिबतमश्विना युवं मदस्य चारुणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya pibatamaśvinā yuvaṃ madasya cāruṇaḥ |
Translation: 14 Ye Aśvins whom our minds perceive, drink of this lovely gladdening draught,

Sanskit Text: मध्वो रातस्यधिष्ण्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhvo rātasyadhiṣṇyā ||
Translation: The mcath which we present to you.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे आ वहतं रयिं शतवन्तं सहस्रिणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme ā vahataṃ rayiṃ śatavantaṃ sahasriṇam |
Translation: 15 Bring riches hither unto us in hundreds and in thousands, source

Sanskit Text: पुरुक्षुं विश्वधायसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purukṣuṃ viśvadhāyasam ||
Translation: Of plenteous food, sustaining all.

Sanskit Text: पुरुत्रा चिद धि वां नरा विह्वयन्ते मनीषिणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purutrā cid dhi vāṃ narā vihvayante manīṣiṇaḥ |
Translation: 16 Verily sages call on you, ye Heroes, in full many a place.

Sanskit Text: वाघद्भिरश्विना गतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāghadbhiraśvinā ghatam ||
Translation: Moved by the priests, O Aśvins, conic.

Sanskit Text: जनासो वर्क्तबर्हिषो हविष्मन्तो अरंक्र्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: janāso vṛktabarhiṣo haviṣmanto araṃkṛtaḥ |
Translation: 17 Men who have trimmed the sacred grass, bringing oblations and prepared,

Sanskit Text: युवां हवन्ते अश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvāṃ havante aśvinā ||
Translation: O Aśvins, are invoking you.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकमद्य वामयं सतोमो वाहिष्ठो अन्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākamadya vāmayaṃ stomo vāhiṣṭho antamaḥ |
Translation: 18 May this our hymn of praise to-day, most powerful to bring you, be,

Sanskit Text: युवाभ्यां भूत्वश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvābhyāṃ bhūtvaśvinā ||
Translation: O Aśvins, nearest to your hearts.

Sanskit Text: यो ह वां मधुनो दर्तिराहितो रथचर्षणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo ha vāṃ madhuno dṛtirāhito rathacarṣaṇe |
Translation: 19 The skin filled full of savoury meath, laid in the pathway of your car-

Sanskit Text: ततः पिबतमश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tataḥ pibatamaśvinā ||
Translation: O Aśvins, drink ye both therefrom.

Sanskit Text: तेन नो वाजिनीवसू पश्वे तोकाय शं गवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tena no vājinīvasū paśve tokāya śaṃ ghave |
Translation: 20 For this, ye Lords of ample wealth, bring blessing for our herd, our kine,

Sanskit Text: वहतं पीवरीरिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vahataṃ pīvarīriṣaḥ ||
Translation: Our progeny, and plenteous food.

Sanskit Text: उत नो दिव्या इष उत सिन्धून्रहर्विदा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta no divyā iṣa uta sindhūnraharvidā |
Translation: 21 Ye too unclose to us like doors the strengthening waters of the sky,

Sanskit Text: अप दवारेव वर्षथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa dvāreva varṣathaḥ ||
Translation: And rivers, ye who find the day.

Sanskit Text: कदा वां तौग्र्यो विधत समुद्रे जहितो नरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadā vāṃ taughryo vidhat samudre jahito narā |
Translation: 22 When did the son of Tugra serve you, Men? Abandoned in the sea,

Sanskit Text: यद वां रथो विभिष पतात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vāṃ ratho vibhiṣ patāt ||
Translation: That with winged steeds your car might fly.

Sanskit Text: युवं कण्वाय नासत्यापिरिप्ताय हर्म्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ kaṇvāya nāsatyāpiriptāya harmye |
Translation: 23 Ye, O Nāsatyas, ministered to Kaṇva with repeated aid,

Sanskit Text: शश्वदूतीर्दशस्यथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaśvadūtīrdaśasyathaḥ ||
Translation: When cast into the heated pit.

Sanskit Text: ताभिरा यातमूतिभिर्नव्यसीभिः सुशस्तिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tābhirā yātamūtibhirnavyasībhiḥ suśastibhiḥ |
Translation: 24 Come near with those most recent aids of yours which merit eulogy,

Sanskit Text: यद वां वर्षण्वसू हुवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū huve ||
Translation: When I invoke you, Wealthy Gods.

Sanskit Text: यथा चित कण्वमावतं परियमेधमुपस्तुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā cit kaṇvamāvataṃ priyamedhamupastutam |
Translation: 25 As ye protected Kaṇva erst, Priyamedha and Upastuta,

Sanskit Text: अत्रिं शिञ्जारमश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atriṃ śiñjāramaśvinā ||
Translation: Atri, Sinjara, Aśvins Twain

Sanskit Text: यथोत कर्त्व्ये धने.अंशुं गोष्वगस्त्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathota kṛtvye dhane.aṃśuṃ ghoṣvaghastyam |
Translation: 26 And Amsu in decisive fight, Agastya in the fray for kine.

Sanskit Text: यथा वाजेषु सोभरिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā vājeṣu sobharim ||
Translation: And, in his battles, Sobhari.

Sanskit Text: एतावद वां वर्षण्वसू अतो वा भूयो अश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etāvad vāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū ato vā bhūyo aśvinā |
Translation: 27 For so much bliss, or even more, O Aśvins, Wealthy Gods, than this,

Sanskit Text: गर्णन्तः सुम्नमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛṇantaḥ sumnamīmahe ||
Translation: We pray white singing hymns to you.

Sanskit Text: रथं हिरण्यवन्धुरं हिरण्याभीशुमश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathaṃ hiraṇyavandhuraṃ hiraṇyābhīśumaśvinā |
Translation: 28 Ascend your car with golden seat, O Aśvins, and with reins of gold,

Sanskit Text: आ हि सथाथो दिविस्प्र्शम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā hi sthātho divispṛśam ||
Translation: That reaches even to the sky.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्ययी वां रभिरीषा अक्षो हिरण्ययः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyayī vāṃ rabhirīṣā akṣo hiraṇyayaḥ |
Translation: 29 Golden is its supporting shaft, the axle also is of gold,

Sanskit Text: उभा चक्रा हिरण्यया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhā cakrā hiraṇyayā ||
Translation: And both the wheels are made of gold.

Sanskit Text: तेन नो वाजिनीवसू परावतश्चिदा गतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tena no vājinīvasū parāvataścidā ghatam |
Translation: 30 Thereon, ye Lords of ample wealth, come to us even from afar,

Sanskit Text: उपेमां सुष्टुतिं मम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upemāṃ suṣṭutiṃ mama ||
Translation: Come ye to this mine eulogy.

Sanskit Text: आ वहेथे पराकात पूर्वीरश्नन्तावश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vahethe parākāt pūrvīraśnantāvaśvinā |
Translation: 31 From far away ye come to us, Aśvins, enjoying plenteous food

Sanskit Text: इषो दासीरमर्त्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣo dāsīramartyā ||
Translation: Of Dāsas, O Immortal Ones.

Sanskit Text: आ नो दयुम्नैरा शरवोभिरा राया यातमश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no dyumnairā śravobhirā rāyā yātamaśvinā |
Translation: 32 With splendour, riches, and renown, O Aśvins, hither come to us,

Sanskit Text: पुरुश्चन्द्रा नासत्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: puruścandrā nāsatyā ||
Translation: Nāsatyas, shining brilliantly.

Sanskit Text: एह वां परुषितप्सवो वयो वहन्तु पर्णिनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eha vāṃ pruṣitapsavo vayo vahantu parṇinaḥ |
Translation: 33 May dappled horses, steeds who fly with pinions, bring you hitherward

Sanskit Text: अछा सवध्वरं जनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā svadhvaraṃ janam ||
Translation: To people skilled in sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: रथं वामनुगायसं य इषा वर्तते सह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathaṃ vāmanughāyasaṃ ya iṣā vartate saha |
Translation: 34 The whcel delayeth not that car of yours accompanied by song,

Sanskit Text: न चक्रमभि बाधते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na cakramabhi bādhate ||
Translation: That cometh with a store of food.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्ययेन रथेन दरवत्पाणिभिरश्वैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyayena rathena dravatpāṇibhiraśvaiḥ |
Translation: 35 Borne on that chariot wrought of gold, with coursers very fleet of foot,

Sanskit Text: धीजवना नासत्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhījavanā nāsatyā ||
Translation: Come, O Nāsatyas, swift as thought.

Sanskit Text: युवं मर्गं जाग्र्वांसं सवदथो वा वर्षण्वसू |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ mṛghaṃ jāghṛvāṃsaṃ svadatho vā vṛṣaṇvasū |
Translation: 36 O Wealthy Gods, ye taste and find the brisk and watchful wild beast good.

Sanskit Text: ता नःप्र्ङकतमिषा रयिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā naḥpṛṅktamiṣā rayim ||
Translation: Associate wealth with food for us.

Sanskit Text: ता मे अश्विना सनीनां विद्यातं नवानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā me aśvinā sanīnāṃ vidyātaṃ navānām |
Translation: 37 As such, O Aśvins, find for me my share of new-presented gifts,

Sanskit Text: यथा चिच्चैद्यः कशुः शतमुष्ट्रानां ददत सहस्रा दश गोनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā ciccaidyaḥ kaśuḥ śatamuṣṭrānāṃ dadat sahasrā daśa ghonām ||
Translation: As Kasu, Cedi's son, gave me a hundred head of buffaloes, and ten thousand kine.

Sanskit Text: यो मे हिरण्यसन्द्र्शो दश राज्ञो अमंहत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo me hiraṇyasandṛśo daśa rājño amaṃhata |
Translation: 38 He who hath given me for mine own ten Kings like gold to look upon.

Sanskit Text: अधस्पदा इच्चैद्यस्य कर्ष्टयश्चर्मम्ना अभितो जनाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhaspadā iccaidyasya kṛṣṭayaścarmamnā abhito janāḥ ||
Translation: At Caidya's feet are all the people round about, all those who think upon the shield.

Sanskit Text: माकिरेना पथा गाद येनेमे यन्ति चेदयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mākirenā pathā ghād yeneme yanti cedayaḥ |
Translation: 39 No man, not any, goes upon the path on which the Cedis walk.

Sanskit Text: अन्यो नेत सूरिरोहते भूरिदावत्तरो जनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anyo net sūrirohate bhūridāvattaro janaḥ ||
Translation: No other prince, no folk is held more liberal of gifts than they.

Sanskit Text: पर यद वस्त्रिष्टुभमिषं मरुतो विप्रो अक्षरत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yad vastriṣṭubhamiṣaṃ maruto vipro akṣarat |
Translation: 1. O MARUTS, when the sage hath poured the Tṛṣṭup forth as food for you,

Sanskit Text: वि पर्वतेषु राजथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi parvateṣu rājatha ||
Translation: Ye shine amid the mountain-clouds.

Sanskit Text: यदङग तविषीयवो यामं शुभ्रा अचिध्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadaṅgha taviṣīyavo yāmaṃ śubhrā acidhvam |
Translation: 2 When, Bright Ones, fain to show your might ye have determined on your course,

Sanskit Text: नि पर्वता अहासत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni parvatā ahāsata ||
Translation: The mountain-clouds have bent them down.

Sanskit Text: उदीरयन्त वायुभिर्वाश्रासः पर्श्निमातरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udīrayanta vāyubhirvāśrāsaḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ |
Translation: 3 Loud roaring with the winds the Sons of Pṛśni have upraised themselves:

Sanskit Text: धुक्षन्तपिप्युशीमिषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhukṣantapipyuśīmiṣam ||
Translation: They have poured out the streaming food.

Sanskit Text: वपन्ति मरुतो मिहं पर वेपयन्ति पर्वतान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vapanti maruto mihaṃ pra vepayanti parvatān |
Translation: 4 The Maruts spread the mist abroad and make mountains rock and reel,

Sanskit Text: यद यामं यान्ति वायुभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad yāmaṃ yānti vāyubhiḥ ||
Translation: When with the winds they go their way

Sanskit Text: नि यद यामाय वो गिरिर्नि सिन्धवो विधर्मणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni yad yāmāya vo ghirirni sindhavo vidharmaṇe |
Translation: 5 What time the rivers and the hills before your coming bowed them down,

Sanskit Text: महे शुष्माय येमिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahe śuṣmāya yemire ||
Translation: So to sustain your mighty force.

Sanskit Text: युष्मानु नक्तमूतये युष्मान दिवा हवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmānu naktamūtaye yuṣmān divā havāmahe |
Translation: 6 We call on you for aid by night, on you for succour in the day,

Sanskit Text: युष्मान परयत्यध्वरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmān prayatyadhvare ||
Translation: On you while sacrifice proceeds.

Sanskit Text: उदु तये अरुणप्सवश्चित्रा यामेभिरीरते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udu tye aruṇapsavaścitrā yāmebhirīrate |
Translation: 7 These, verily, wondrous, red of hue, speed on their courses with a roar

Sanskit Text: वाश्रा अधिष्णुना दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāśrā adhiṣṇunā divaḥ ||
Translation: Over the ridges of the sky.

Sanskit Text: सर्जन्ति रश्मिमोजसा पन्थां सूर्याय यातवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sṛjanti raśmimojasā panthāṃ sūryāya yātave |
Translation: 8 With might they drop the loosened rein so that the Sun may run his course,

Sanskit Text: ते भानुभिर्वि तस्थिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te bhānubhirvi tasthire ||
Translation: And spread themselves with beams of light.

Sanskit Text: इमां मे मरुतो गिरमिमं सतोमं रभुक्षणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imāṃ me maruto ghiramimaṃ stomaṃ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ |
Translation: 9 Accept, ye Maruts, this my song, accept ye this mine hymn of praise,

Sanskit Text: इमं मे वनता हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ me vanatā havam ||
Translation: Accept, Ṛbhukṣans, this my call.

Sanskit Text: तरीणि सरांसि पर्श्नयो दुदुह्रे वज्रिणे मधु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trīṇi sarāṃsi pṛśnayo duduhre vajriṇe madhu |
Translation: 10 The dappled Cows have poured three lakes, meath for the Thunder-wielding God,

Sanskit Text: उत्सं कवन्धमुद्रिणम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utsaṃ kavandhamudriṇam ||
Translation: From the great cask, the watery cloud.

Sanskit Text: मरुतो यद ध वो दिवः सुम्नायन्तो हवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: maruto yad dha vo divaḥ sumnāyanto havāmahe |
Translation: 11 O Maruts, quickly come to us when, longing for felicity,

Sanskit Text: आ तू न उपगन्तन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tū na upaghantana ||
Translation: We call you hither from the sky.

Sanskit Text: यूयं हि षठा सुदानवो रुद्रा रभुक्षणो दमे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā sudānavo rudrā ṛbhukṣaṇo dame |
Translation: 12 For, Rudras and Ṛbhukṣans, ye, Most Bountiful, are in the house,

Sanskit Text: उत परचेतसो मदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta pracetaso made ||
Translation: Wise when the gladdening draught is drunk.

Sanskit Text: आ नो रयिं मदच्युतं पुरुक्षुं विश्वधायसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no rayiṃ madacyutaṃ purukṣuṃ viśvadhāyasam |
Translation: 13 O Maruts, send us down from heaven riches distilling rapturous joy,

Sanskit Text: इयर्ता मरुतो दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyartā maruto divaḥ ||
Translation: With plenteous food, sustaining all.

Sanskit Text: अधीव यद गिरीणां यामं शुभ्रा अचिध्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhīva yad ghirīṇāṃ yāmaṃ śubhrā acidhvam |
Translation: 14 When, Bright Ones, hither from the hills ye have resolved to take your way,

Sanskit Text: सुवानैर्मन्दध्व इन्दुभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvānairmandadhva indubhiḥ ||
Translation: Ye revel in the drops effused.

Sanskit Text: एतावतश्चिदेषां सुम्नं भिक्षेत मर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etāvataścideṣāṃ sumnaṃ bhikṣeta martyaḥ |
Translation: 15 Man should solicit with his lauds happiness which belongs to them,

Sanskit Text: अदाभ्यस्य मन्मभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adābhyasya manmabhiḥ ||
Translation: So great a band invincible.

Sanskit Text: ये दरप्सा इव रोदसी धमन्त्यनु वर्ष्टिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye drapsā iva rodasī dhamantyanu vṛṣṭibhiḥ |
Translation: 16 They who like fiery sparks with showers of rain blow through the heaven and earth,

Sanskit Text: उत्सं दुहन्तो अक्षितम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utsaṃ duhanto akṣitam ||
Translation: Milking the spring that never fails.

Sanskit Text: उदु सवानेभिरीरत उद रथैरुदु वायुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udu svānebhirīrata ud rathairudu vāyubhiḥ |
Translation: 17 With chariots and tumultuous roar, with tempests and with hymns of praise

Sanskit Text: उत सतोमैः पर्श्निमातरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut stomaiḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ ||
Translation: The Sons of Pṛśni hurry forth.

Sanskit Text: येनाव तुर्वशं यदुं येन कण्वं धनस्प्र्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenāva turvaśaṃ yaduṃ yena kaṇvaṃ dhanaspṛtam |
Translation: 18 For wealth, we think of that whereby ye aided Yadu, Turvaśa,

Sanskit Text: राये सु तस्य धीमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāye su tasya dhīmahi ||
Translation: And KanVa who obtained the spoil.

Sanskit Text: इमा उ वः सुदानवो घर्तं न पिप्युषीरिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā u vaḥ sudānavo ghṛtaṃ na pipyuṣīriṣaḥ |
Translation: 19 May these our viands Bounteous Ones I that flow in streams like holy oil,

Sanskit Text: वर्धान काण्वस्य मन्मभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vardhān kāṇvasya manmabhiḥ ||
Translation: With Kaṇva's hymns, increase your might.

Sanskit Text: कव नूनं सुदानवो मदथा वर्क्तबर्हिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kva nūnaṃ sudānavo madathā vṛktabarhiṣaḥ |
Translation: 20 Where, Bounteous Lords for whom the grass is trimmed, are ye rejoicing now?

Sanskit Text: बरह्मा को वःसपर्यति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmā ko vaḥsaparyati ||
Translation: What Brahman is adoring you?

Sanskit Text: नहि षम यद ध वः पुरा सतोमेभिर्व्र्क्तबर्हिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi ṣma yad dha vaḥ purā stomebhirvṛktabarhiṣaḥ |
Translation: 21 Is it not there where ye of old, supplied with sacred grass, for lauds

Sanskit Text: शर्धान रतस्य जिन्वथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śardhān ṛtasya jinvatha ||
Translation: Inspired the strong in sacrifice?

Sanskit Text: समु तये महतीरपः सं कषोणी समु सूर्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samu tye mahatīrapaḥ saṃ kṣoṇī samu sūryam |
Translation: 22 They brought together both the worlds, the mighty waters, and the Sun,

Sanskit Text: सं वज्रं पर्वशो दधुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ vajraṃ parvaśo dadhuḥ ||
Translation: And, joint by joint, the thunderbolt.

Sanskit Text: वि वर्त्रं पर्वशो ययुर्वि पर्वतानराजिनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi vṛtraṃ parvaśo yayurvi parvatānarājinaḥ |
Translation: 23 They sundered Vṛtra limb from limb and split the gloomy mountain-clouds,

Sanskit Text: चक्राणा वर्ष्णि पौंस्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakrāṇā vṛṣṇi pauṃsyam ||
Translation: Performing a heroic deed.

Sanskit Text: अनु तरितस्य युध्यतः शुष्ममावन्नुत करतुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu tritasya yudhyataḥ śuṣmamāvannuta kratum |
Translation: 24 They reinforced the power and strength of Trita as he fought, and helped

Sanskit Text: अन्विन्द्रं वर्त्रतूर्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anvindraṃ vṛtratūrye ||
Translation: Indra in battle with the foe.

Sanskit Text: विद्युद्धस्ता अभिद्यवः शिप्राः शीर्षन हिरण्ययीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidyuddhastā abhidyavaḥ śiprāḥ śīrṣan hiraṇyayīḥ |
Translation: 25 They deck themselves for glory, bright, celestial, lightning in their hands,

Sanskit Text: शुभ्रा वयञ्जत शरिये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śubhrā vyañjata śriye ||
Translation: And helms of gold upon their heads.

Sanskit Text: उशना यत परावत उक्ष्णो रन्ध्रमयातन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uśanā yat parāvata ukṣṇo randhramayātana |
Translation: 26 When eagerly ye from far away came to the cavern of the Bull,

Sanskit Text: दयौर्न चक्रदद भिया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyaurna cakradad bhiyā ||
Translation: He bellowed in his fear like Heaven.

Sanskit Text: आ नो मखस्य दावने.अश्वैर्हिरण्यपाणिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no makhasya dāvane.aśvairhiraṇyapāṇibhiḥ |
Translation: 27 Borne by your golden-footed steeds, O Gods, come hither to receive

Sanskit Text: देवास उप गन्तन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāsa upa ghantana ||
Translation: The sacrifice we offer you.

Sanskit Text: यदेषां पर्षती रथे परष्टिर्वहति रोहितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadeṣāṃ pṛṣatī rathe praṣṭirvahati rohitaḥ |
Translation: 28 When the red leader draws along their spotted deer yoked to the car.

Sanskit Text: यान्ति शुभ्रा रिणन्नपः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yānti śubhrā riṇannapaḥ ||
Translation: The Bright Ones come, and shed the rain.

Sanskit Text: सुषोमे शर्यणावत्यार्जीके पस्त्यावति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suṣome śaryaṇāvatyārjīke pastyāvati |
Translation: 29 Susoma, Saryakiavan, and Arjika full of homes, have they.

Sanskit Text: ययुर्निचक्रया नरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayurnicakrayā naraḥ ||
Translation: These Heroes, sought with downward car.

Sanskit Text: कदा गछाथ मरुत इत्था विप्रं हवमानम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadā ghachātha maruta itthā vipraṃ havamānam |
Translation: 30 When, Maruts, ye come to him, the singer who invokes you thus,

Sanskit Text: मार्डीकेभिर्नाधमानम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mārḍīkebhirnādhamānam ||
Translation: With favours to your suppliant?

Sanskit Text: कद ध नूनं कधप्रियो यदिन्द्रमजहातन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kad dha nūnaṃ kadhapriyo yadindramajahātana |
Translation: 31 What now? where have ye still a friend since ye left Indra all alone?

Sanskit Text: को वः सखित्व ओहते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko vaḥ sakhitva ohate ||
Translation: Who counteth on your friendship now?

Sanskit Text: सहो षु णो वज्रहस्तैः कण्वासो अग्निं मरुद्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saho ṣu ṇo vajrahastaiḥ kaṇvāso aghniṃ marudbhiḥ |
Translation: 32 The Kaṇvas sing forth Agni's praise together with our Maruts’ who

Sanskit Text: सतुषेहिरण्यवाशीभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stuṣehiraṇyavāśībhiḥ ||
Translation: Wield thunder and wear swords of gold.

Sanskit Text: ओ षु वर्ष्णः परयज्यूना नव्यसे सुविताय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: o ṣu vṛṣṇaḥ prayajyūnā navyase suvitāya |
Translation: 33 Hither for new felicity may I attract the Impetuous Ones,

Sanskit Text: वव्र्त्यां चित्रवाजान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vavṛtyāṃ citravājān ||
Translation: The Heroes with their wondrous strength

Sanskit Text: गिरयश्चिन नि जिहते पर्शानासो मन्यमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghirayaścin ni jihate parśānāso manyamānāḥ |
Translation: 34 Before them sink the very hills deerning themseives abysses: yea,

Sanskit Text: पर्वताश्चिन नि येमिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parvatāścin ni yemire ||
Translation: Even the mountains bend them down.

Sanskit Text: आक्ष्णयावानो वहन्त्यन्तरिक्षेण पततः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ākṣṇayāvāno vahantyantarikṣeṇa patataḥ |
Translation: 35 Steeds flying on their tortuous path through mid-air carry them, and give

Sanskit Text: धातारः सतुवते वयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhātāraḥ stuvate vayaḥ ||
Translation: The man who lauds them strength and life.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्हि जानि पूर्व्यश्छन्दो न सूरो अर्चिषा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirhi jāni pūrvyaśchando na sūro arciṣā |
Translation: 36 Agni was born the first of all, like Sūrya lovely with his light:

Sanskit Text: ते भानुभिर्वि तस्थिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te bhānubhirvi tasthire ||
Translation: With lustre these have spread abroad.

Sanskit Text: आ नो विश्वाभिरूतिभिरश्विना गछतं युवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no viśvābhirūtibhiraśvinā ghachataṃ yuvam |
Translation: 1. WITH all the succours that are yours, O Aśvins, hither come to us:

Sanskit Text: दस्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी पिबतं सोम्यं मधु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dasrā hiraṇyavartanī pibataṃ somyaṃ madhu ||
Translation: Wonderful, borne on paths of gold, drink ye the meath with Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: आ नूनं यातमश्विना रथेन सूर्यत्वचा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā nūnaṃ yātamaśvinā rathena sūryatvacā |
Translation: 2 Come now, ye Aśvins, on your car decked with a sun-bright canopy,

Sanskit Text: भुजी हिरण्यपेशसा कवी गम्भीरचेतसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhujī hiraṇyapeśasā kavī ghambhīracetasā ||
Translation: Bountiful, with your golden forms, Sages with depth of intellect.

Sanskit Text: आ यातं नहुषस पर्यान्तरिक्षात सुव्र्क्तिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yātaṃ nahuṣas paryāntarikṣāt suvṛktibhiḥ |
Translation: 3 Come hither from the Nahusas, come, drawn by pure hymns, from mid-air.

Sanskit Text: पिबाथोश्विना मधु कण्वानां सवने सुतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibāthoaśvinā madhu kaṇvānāṃ savane sutam ||
Translation: O Aśvins, drink the savoury juice shed in the Kaṇvas' sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: आ नो यातं दिवस पर्यान्तरिक्षादधप्रिया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no yātaṃ divas paryāntarikṣādadhapriyā |
Translation: 4 Come to us hither from the heavens, come from mid-air, well-loved by us:

Sanskit Text: पुत्रः कण्वस्य वामिह सुषाव सोम्यं मधु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: putraḥ kaṇvasya vāmiha suṣāva somyaṃ madhu ||
Translation: Here Kaṇva's son hath pressed for you the pleasant meath of Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: आ नो यातमुपश्रुत्यश्विना सोमपीतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no yātamupaśrutyaśvinā somapītaye |
Translation: 5 Come, Aśvins, to give car to us, to drink the Soma, Aśvins, come.

Sanskit Text: सवाहा सतोमस्य वर्धना पर कवी धीतिभिर्नरा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāhā stomasya vardhanā pra kavī dhītibhirnarā ||
Translation: Hail, Strengtheners of the praise-song speed onward, ye Heroes, with your thoughts.

Sanskit Text: यच्चिद धि वां पुर रषयो जुहूरे.अवसे नरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaccid dhi vāṃ pura ṛṣayo juhūre.avase narā |
Translation: 6 As, Heroes, in the olden time the Ṛṣis called you to their aid,

Sanskit Text: आ यातमश्विना गतमुपेमां सुष्टुतिं मम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yātamaśvinā ghatamupemāṃ suṣṭutiṃ mama ||
Translation: So now, O Aśvins, come to us, come near to this mine eulogy.

Sanskit Text: दिवश्चिद रोचनादध्या नो गन्तं सवर्विदा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divaścid rocanādadhyā no ghantaṃ svarvidā |
Translation: 7 Even from the luminous sphere of heaven come to us, ye who find the light,

Sanskit Text: धीभिर्वत्सप्रचेतसा सतोमेभिर्हवनश्रुता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhībhirvatsapracetasā stomebhirhavanaśrutā ||
Translation: Carers for Vatsa, through our prayers and lauds, O yewho hearour call.

Sanskit Text: किमन्ये पर्यासते.अस्मत सतोमेभिरश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kimanye paryāsate.asmat stomebhiraśvinā |
Translation: 8 Do others more than we adore the Aśvins with their hymns of praise?

Sanskit Text: पुत्रः कण्वस्य वां रषिर्गीर्भिर्वत्सो अवीव्र्धत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: putraḥ kaṇvasya vāṃ ṛṣirghīrbhirvatso avīvṛdhat ||
Translation: The Ṛṣi Vatsa, Kaṇva's son, hath magnified you with his songs.

Sanskit Text: आ वां विप्र इहावसे.अह्वत सतोमेभिरश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ vipra ihāvase.ahvat stomebhiraśvinā |
Translation: 9 The holy singer with his hymns hath called you, Aśvins, hither-ward;

Sanskit Text: अरिप्रा वर्त्रहन्तमा ता नो भूतं मयोभुवा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ariprā vṛtrahantamā tā no bhūtaṃ mayobhuvā ||
Translation: Best Vṛtra-slayers, free from stain, as such bring us felicity.

Sanskit Text: आ यद वां योषणा रथमतिष्ठद वाजिनीवसू |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yad vāṃ yoṣaṇā rathamatiṣṭhad vājinīvasū |
Translation: 10 What time, ye Lords of ample wealth, the Lady mounted on your car,

Sanskit Text: विश्वान्यश्विना युवं पर धीतान्यगछतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvānyaśvinā yuvaṃ pra dhītānyaghachatam ||
Translation: Then, O ye Aśvins, ye attained all wishes that your hearts desired.

Sanskit Text: अतः सहस्रनिर्णिजा रथेना यातमश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ataḥ sahasranirṇijā rathenā yātamaśvinā |
Translation: 11 Come thence, O Aśvins, on your car that hath a thousand ornaments:

Sanskit Text: वत्सो वां मधुमद वचो.अशंसीत काव्यः कविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vatso vāṃ madhumad vaco.aśaṃsīt kāvyaḥ kaviḥ ||
Translation: Vatsa the sage, the sage's son, hath sung a song of sweets to you.

Sanskit Text: पुरुमन्द्रा पुरूवसू मनोतरा रयीणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purumandrā purūvasū manotarā rayīṇām |
Translation: 12 Cheerers of many, rich in goods, discoverers of opulence,

Sanskit Text: सतोमं मे अश्विनाविममभि वह्नी अनूषाताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stomaṃ me aśvināvimamabhi vahnī anūṣātām ||
Translation: The Aśvins, Riders through the sky, have welcomed this my song of praise.

Sanskit Text: आ नो विश्वान्यश्विना धत्तं राधांस्यह्रया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no viśvānyaśvinā dhattaṃ rādhāṃsyahrayā |
Translation: 13 O Aśvins, grant us all rich gifts wherewith no man mav interfere.

Sanskit Text: कर्तं न रत्वियावतो मा नो रीरधतं निदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛtaṃ na ṛtviyāvato mā no rīradhataṃ nide ||
Translation: Make us observe the stated times: give us not over to reproach.

Sanskit Text: यन नास्त्या परावति यद वा सथो अध्यम्बरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yan nāastyā parāvati yad vā stho adhyambare |
Translation: 14 Whether, Nāsatyas, ye be nigh, or whether ye be far away,

Sanskit Text: अतः सहस्रनिर्णिजा रथेना यातमश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ataḥ sahasranirṇijā rathenā yātamaśvinā ||
Translation: Come thence, O Aśvins, on your car that hath a thousand ornaments.

Sanskit Text: यो वां नासत्याव रषिर्गीर्भिर्वत्सो अवीव्र्धत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vāṃ nāsatyāv ṛṣirghīrbhirvatso avīvṛdhat |
Translation: 15 Vatsa the Ṛṣi with his songs, Nāsatyas, hath exalted you:

Sanskit Text: तस्मै सहस्रनिर्णिजमिषं धत्तं घर्तश्चुतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmai sahasranirṇijamiṣaṃ dhattaṃ ghṛtaścutam ||
Translation: Grant him rich food distilling oil, graced with a thousand ornaments.

Sanskit Text: परास्मा ऊर्जं घर्तश्चुतमश्विना यछतं युवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāsmā ūrjaṃ ghṛtaścutamaśvinā yachataṃ yuvam |
Translation: 16 Bestow on him, O Aśvins, food that strengthens, and that drops with oil,

Sanskit Text: यो वां सुम्नाय तुष्टवद वसूयाद दानुनस पती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vāṃ sumnāya tuṣṭavad vasūyād dānunas patī ||
Translation: On him who praises you for bliss, and, Lords of bounty, prays for wealth.

Sanskit Text: आ नो गन्तं रिशादसेमं सतोमं पुरुभुजा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no ghantaṃ riśādasemaṃ stomaṃ purubhujā |
Translation: 17 Come to us, ye who slay the foe, Lords of rich treasure, to this hymn.

Sanskit Text: कर्तं नः सुश्रियो नरेमा दातमभिष्टये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛtaṃ naḥ suśriyo naremā dātamabhiṣṭaye ||
Translation: O Heroes, give us high renown and these good things of earth for help.

Sanskit Text: आ वां विश्वाभिरूतिभिः परियमेधा अहूषत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ viśvābhirūtibhiḥ priyamedhā ahūṣata |
Translation: 18 The Priyamedhas have invoked you with all succours that are yours,

Sanskit Text: राजन्तावध्वराणामश्विना यामहूतिषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājantāvadhvarāṇāmaśvinā yāmahūtiṣu ||
Translation: You, Aśvins, Lords of solemn rites, with calls entreating you to come.

Sanskit Text: आ नो गन्तं मयोभुवाश्विना शम्भुवा युवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no ghantaṃ mayobhuvāśvinā śambhuvā yuvam |
Translation: 19 Come to us, Aśvins, ye Who bring felicity, auspicious Ones,

Sanskit Text: यो वां विपन्यू धीतिभिर्गीर्भिर्वत्सो अवीव्र्धत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vāṃ vipanyū dhītibhirghīrbhirvatso avīvṛdhat ||
Translation: To Vatsa who with prayer and hymn, lovers of song, hath honoured you.

Sanskit Text: याभिः कण्वं मेधातिथिं याभिर्वशं दशव्रजम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ kaṇvaṃ medhātithiṃ yābhirvaśaṃ daśavrajam |
Translation: 20 Aid us, O Heroes, for those hymns for which ye helped GoSarya erst,

Sanskit Text: याभिर्गोशर्यमावतं ताभिर्नो.अवतं नरा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirghośaryamāvataṃ tābhirno.avataṃ narā ||
Translation: Gave Vaśa, Dasavraja aid, and Kaṇva and Medhatithi:

Sanskit Text: याभिर्नरा तरसदस्युमावतं कर्त्व्ये धने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirnarā trasadasyumāvataṃ kṛtvye dhane |
Translation: 21 And favoured Trasadasyu, ye Heroes, in spoil-deciding fray:

Sanskit Text: ताभिः षवस्मानश्विना परावतं वाजसातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tābhiḥ ṣvasmānaśvinā prāvataṃ vājasātaye ||
Translation: For these, O Aśvins, graciously assist us in acquiring strength.

Sanskit Text: पर वां सतोमाः सुव्र्क्तयो गिरो वर्धन्त्वश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vāṃ stomāḥ suvṛktayo ghiro vardhantvaśvinā |
Translation: 22 O Aśvins, may pure hymns of ours, and songs and praises, honour you:

Sanskit Text: पुरुत्रा वर्त्रहन्तमा ता नो भूतं पुरुस्प्र्हा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purutrā vṛtrahantamā tā no bhūtaṃ puruspṛhā ||
Translation: Best slayers everywhere of foes, as such we fondly yearn for you.

Sanskit Text: तरीणि पदान्यश्विनोराविः सान्ति गुहा परः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trīṇi padānyaśvinorāviḥ sānti ghuhā paraḥ |
Translation: 23 Three places of the Aśvins, erst concealed, are made apparent now.

Sanskit Text: कवी रतस्य पत्मभिरर्वाग जीवेभ्यस परि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kavī ṛtasya patmabhirarvāgh jīvebhyas pari ||
Translation: Both Sages, with the flight of Law come hither unto those who live.

Sanskit Text: यत सथो दीर्घप्रसद्मनि यद वादो रोचने दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat stho dīrghaprasadmani yad vādo rocane divaḥ |
Translation: 1. WHETHER ye travel far away or dwell in yonder light of heaven,

Sanskit Text: यद वा समुद्रे अध्याक्र्ते गर्हे.अत आ यातमश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā samudre adhyākṛte ghṛhe.ata ā yātamaśvinā ||
Translation: Or in a mansion that is built above the sea, come thence, ye Aśvins, hitherward.

Sanskit Text: यद वा यज्ञं मनवे सम्मिमिक्षथुरेवेत काण्वस्य बोधतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā yajñaṃ manave sammimikṣathurevet kāṇvasya bodhatam |
Translation: 2 Or if for Manu.ye prepared the sacrifice, remember also Kaṇva's son.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिं विश्वान देवानहं हुव इन्द्राविष्णू अश्विनावाशुहेषसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiṃ viśvān devānahaṃ huva indrāviṣṇū aśvināvāśuheṣasā ||
Translation: I call Bṛhaspati, Indra, Viṣṇu, all the gods, the Aśvins borne by rapid steeds.

Sanskit Text: तया नवश्विना हुवे सुदंससा गर्भे कर्ता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tyā nvaśvinā huve sudaṃsasā ghṛbhe kṛtā |
Translation: 3 Those Aśvins I invoke who work marvels, brought hither to receive,

Sanskit Text: ययोरस्ति परणः सख्यं देवेष्वध्याप्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayorasti praṇaḥ sakhyaṃ deveṣvadhyāpyam ||
Translation: With whom our friendship is most famed, and kinship passing that of Gods.

Sanskit Text: ययोरधि पर यज्ञा असूरे सन्ति सूरयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayoradhi pra yajñā asūre santi sūrayaḥ |
Translation: 4 On whom the solemn rites depend, whose worshippers rise without the Sun:

Sanskit Text: ता यज्ञस्याध्वरस्य परचेतसा सवधाभिर्या पिबतः सोम्यं मधु ||
