Sanskrit Transliteration: tā yajñasyādhvarasya pracetasā svadhābhiryā pibataḥ somyaṃ madhu ||
Translation: These who foreknow the holy work of sacrifice, and by their Godhead drink the sweets of Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: यदद्याश्विनावपाग यत पराक सथो वाजिनीवसू |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadadyāśvināvapāgh yat prāk stho vājinīvasū |
Translation: 5 Whether ye, Lords of ample wealth, now linger in the cast or west,

Sanskit Text: यद दरुह्यव्यनवि तुर्वशे यदौ हुवे वामथ मा गतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad druhyavyanavi turvaśe yadau huve vāmatha mā ghatam ||
Translation: With Druhyu, or with Anu, Yadu, Turvaga, I call you hither; come to me.

Sanskit Text: यदन्तरिक्षे पतथः पुरुभुजा यद वेमे रोदसी अनु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadantarikṣe patathaḥ purubhujā yad veme rodasī anu |
Translation: 6 Lords of great riches, whether through the firmament ye fly or speed through heaven and earth,

Sanskit Text: यद्वा सवधाभिरधितिष्ठथो रथमत आ यातमश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadvā svadhābhiradhitiṣṭhatho rathamata ā yātamaśvinā ||
Translation: Or with your Godlike natures stand upon your cars, come thence, O Aśvins, hitherward.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्ने वरतपा असि देव आ मर्त्येष्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghne vratapā asi deva ā martyeṣvā |
Translation: 1. THOU Agni, God mid mortal men, art guard of sacred rites, thou art

Sanskit Text: तवं यज्ञेष्वीड्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ yajñeṣvīḍyaḥ ||
Translation: To be adored at sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: तवमसि परशस्यो विदथेषु सहन्त्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamasi praśasyo vidatheṣu sahantya |
Translation: 2 O Mighty Agni, thou must be glorified at our festivals,

Sanskit Text: अग्ने रथीरध्वराणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne rathīradhvarāṇām ||
Translation: Bearing our offerings to the Gods.

Sanskit Text: स तवमस्मदप दविषो युयोधि जातवेदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvamasmadapa dviṣo yuyodhi jātavedaḥ |
Translation: 3 O Jātavedas Agni, fight and drive our foes afar from us,

Sanskit Text: अदेवीरग्ने अरातीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adevīraghne arātīḥ ||
Translation: Themand their godless enmities.

Sanskit Text: अन्ति चित सन्तमह यज्ञं मर्तस्य रिपोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anti cit santamaha yajñaṃ martasya ripoḥ |
Translation: 4 Thou, Jātavedas, seekest not the worship of a hostile man,

Sanskit Text: नोप वेषि जातवेदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nopa veṣi jātavedaḥ ||
Translation: However nigh itbe to thee.

Sanskit Text: मर्ता अमर्त्यस्य ते भूरि नाम मनामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: martā amartyasya te bhūri nāma manāmahe |
Translation: 5 We sages, mortals as we are, adore the mighty name oof thee,

Sanskit Text: विप्रासो जातवेदसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viprāso jātavedasaḥ ||
Translation: Immortal Jātavedas' name.

Sanskit Text: विप्रं विप्रासो.अवसे देवं मर्तास ऊतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vipraṃ viprāso.avase devaṃ martāsa ūtaye |
Translation: 6 Sages, we call the Sage to help, mortals, we call the God to aid:

Sanskit Text: अग्निं गीर्भिर्हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ ghīrbhirhavāmahe ||
Translation: We call on Agni with our songs.

Sanskit Text: आ ते वत्सो मनो यमत परमाच्चित सधस्थात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā te vatso mano yamat paramāccit sadhasthāt |
Translation: 7 May Vatsa draw- thy mind away even from thy loftiest dwelling-place,

Sanskit Text: अग्ने तवां कामया गिरा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne tvāṃ kāmayā ghirā ||
Translation: Agni, with song that yearns for thee.

Sanskit Text: पुरुत्रा हि सद्रंं असि विशो विश्वा अनु परभुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purutrā hi sadṛṃṃ asi viśo viśvā anu prabhuḥ |
Translation: 8 Thou art the same in many a place: mid all the people thou art Lord.

Sanskit Text: समत्सुत्वा हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samatsutvā havāmahe ||
Translation: In fray and fightt we call on thee.

Sanskit Text: समत्स्वग्निमवसे वाजयन्तो हवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samatsvaghnimavase vājayanto havāmahe |
Translation: 9 When we are seeking strength we call Agni to help us in the strife,

Sanskit Text: वाजेषु चित्रराधसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājeṣu citrarādhasam ||
Translation: The giver of rich gifts in war.

Sanskit Text: परत्नो हि कमीड्यो अध्वरेषु सनाच्च होता नव्यश्च सत्सि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratno hi kamīḍyo adhvareṣu sanācca hotā navyaśca satsi |
Translation: 10 Ancient, adorablie at sacrifices, Priest from of old, meet for our praise, thou sittest.

Sanskit Text: सवां चाग्ने तन्वं पिप्रयस्वास्मभ्यं च सौभगमा यजस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāṃ cāghne tanvaṃ piprayasvāsmabhyaṃ ca saubhaghamā yajasva ||
Translation: Fill full and satisfy thy body, Agni, and win us happiness by offering worship.

Sanskit Text: य इन्द्र सोमपातमो मदः शविष्ठ चेतति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya indra somapātamo madaḥ śaviṣṭha cetati |
Translation: 1. JOY, Mightiest Indra, known and marked, sprung most from Soma-draughts, wherewith

Sanskit Text: येना हंसि नयत्रिणं तमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenā haṃsi nyatriṇaṃ tamīmahe ||
Translation: Thou smitest down the greedy fiend, for that we long.

Sanskit Text: येना दशग्वमध्रिगुं वेपयन्तं सवर्णरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenā daśaghvamadhrighuṃ vepayantaṃ svarṇaram |
Translation: 2 Wherewith thou bolpest Adhrigu, the great Daśagva, and the God

Sanskit Text: येना समुद्रमाविथा तमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenā samudramāvithā tamīmahe ||
Translation: Who stirs the sunlight, and the sea, for that we long.

Sanskit Text: येन सिन्धुं महीरपो रथानिव परचोदयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena sindhuṃ mahīrapo rathāniva pracodayaḥ |
Translation: 3 Wherewith thou dravest forth like cars Sindhu and all the mighty floods

Sanskit Text: पन्थां रतस्य यातवे तमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: panthāṃ ṛtasya yātave tamīmahe ||
Translation: To go the way ordained by Law, for that we long.

Sanskit Text: इमं सतोममभिष्टये घर्तं न पूतमद्रिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ stomamabhiṣṭaye ghṛtaṃ na pūtamadrivaḥ |
Translation: 4 Accept this laud for aid, made pure like oil, thou Caster of the Stone,

Sanskit Text: येना नुसद्य ओजसा ववक्षिथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenā nusadya ojasā vavakṣitha ||
Translation: Whereby even in a moment thou hast waxen great.

Sanskit Text: इमं जुषस्व गिर्वणः समुद्र इव पिन्वते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ juṣasva ghirvaṇaḥ samudra iva pinvate |
Translation: 5 Be pleased, Song-lover, with this song it flows abundant like the sea.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र विश्वाभिरूतिभिर्ववक्षिथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra viśvābhirūtibhirvavakṣitha ||
Translation: Indra, with all thy succours thou hast waxen great.

Sanskit Text: यो नो देवः परावतः सखित्वनाय मामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo no devaḥ parāvataḥ sakhitvanāya māmahe |
Translation: 6 The God who from afar hath sent gifts to maintain our friendship's bond,

Sanskit Text: दिवो न वर्ष्टिं परथयन ववक्षिथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo na vṛṣṭiṃ prathayan vavakṣitha ||
Translation: Thou. spreading them like rain from heaven, hast waxen great.

Sanskit Text: ववक्षुरस्य केतवो उत वज्रो गभस्त्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vavakṣurasya ketavo uta vajro ghabhastyoḥ |
Translation: 7 The beams that mark him have grown strong, the thunder rests between his arms,

Sanskit Text: यत सूर्यो न रोदसी अवर्धयत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat sūryo na rodasī avardhayat ||
Translation: When, like the Sun, he hath increased both Heaven and Earth.

Sanskit Text: यदि परव्र्द्ध सत्पते सहस्रं महिषानघः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadi pravṛddha satpate sahasraṃ mahiṣānaghaḥ |
Translation: 8 When, Mighty Lord of Heroes, thou didst cat a thousand buffaloes,

Sanskit Text: आदित त इन्द्रियं महि पर वाव्र्धे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādit ta indriyaṃ mahi pra vāvṛdhe ||
Translation: Then grew and waxed exceeding great thine Indra-power.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रः सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिर्न्यर्शसानमोषति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraḥ sūryasya raśmibhirnyarśasānamoṣati |
Translation: 9 Indra consumeth with the rays of Sūrya the malicious man:

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्वनेव सासहिः पर वाव्र्धे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirvaneva sāsahiḥ pra vāvṛdhe ||
Translation: Like Agni conquering the woods, he hath grown strong.

Sanskit Text: इयं त रत्वियावती धीतिरेति नवीयसी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyaṃ ta ṛtviyāvatī dhītireti navīyasī |
Translation: 10 This newest thought of ours that suits the time approaches unto thee:

Sanskit Text: सपर्यन्ती पुरुप्रिया मिमीत इत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saparyantī purupriyā mimīta it ||
Translation: Serving, beloved in many a place it metes and marks.

Sanskit Text: गर्भो यज्ञस्य देवयुः करतुं पुनीत आनुषक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: gharbho yajñasya devayuḥ kratuṃ punīta ānuṣak |
Translation: 11 The pious germ of sacrifice directly purifies the soul.

Sanskit Text: सतोमैरिन्द्रस्य वाव्र्धे मिमीत इत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stomairindrasya vāvṛdhe mimīta it ||
Translation: By Indra's lauds it waxes great, it metes and marks.

Sanskit Text: सनिर्मित्रस्य पप्रथ इन्द्रः सोमस्य पीतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanirmitrasya papratha indraḥ somasya pītaye |
Translation: 12 Indra who wins the friend hath spread himself to drink the Soma-draught:

Sanskit Text: पराची वाशीव सुन्वते मिमीत इत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prācī vāśīva sunvate mimīta it ||
Translation: Like worshipper's dilating praise; it metes and marks.

Sanskit Text: यं विप्रा उक्थवाहसो.अभिप्रमन्दुरायवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ viprā ukthavāhaso.abhipramandurāyavaḥ |
Translation: 13 He whom the sages, living men, have gladdened, offering up their hymns,

Sanskit Text: घर्तं न पिप्य आसन्य रतस्य यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtaṃ na pipya āsany ṛtasya yat ||
Translation: Hath swelled like oil of sacrifice in Agni's mouth.

Sanskit Text: उत सवराजे अदिति सतोममिन्द्राय जीजनत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta svarāje aditi stomamindrāya jījanat |
Translation: 14 Aditi also hath brought forth a hymn for Indra, Sovran Lord:

Sanskit Text: पुरुप्रशस्तमूतय रतस्य यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purupraśastamūtaya ṛtasya yat ||
Translation: The work of sacrifice for help is glorified.

Sanskit Text: अभि वह्नय ऊतये.अनूषत परशस्तये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi vahnaya ūtaye.anūṣata praśastaye |
Translation: 15 The ministering priests have sung their songs for aid and eulogy:

Sanskit Text: न देव विव्रता हरी रतस्य यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na deva vivratā harī ṛtasya yat ||
Translation: God, thy Bays turn not from the rite which Law ordains.

Sanskit Text: यत सोममिन्द्र विष्णवि यद वा घ तरित आप्त्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat somamindra viṣṇavi yad vā gha trita āptye |
Translation: 16 If, Indra, thou drink Soma by Viṣṇu's or Tṛta Āptya's side,

Sanskit Text: यद वा मरुत्सु मन्दसे समिन्दुभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā marutsu mandase samindubhiḥ ||
Translation: Or with the Maruts take delight in flowing drops;

Sanskit Text: यद वा शक्र परावति समुद्रे अधि मन्दसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā śakra parāvati samudre adhi mandase |
Translation: 17 Or, Śakra, if thou gladden thee afar or in the sea of air,

Sanskit Text: अस्माकमित सुते रणा समिन्दुभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākamit sute raṇā samindubhiḥ ||
Translation: Rejoice thee in this juice of ours, in flowing drops.

Sanskit Text: यद वासि सुन्वतो वर्धो यजमानस्य सत्पते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vāsi sunvato vṛdho yajamānasya satpate |
Translation: 18 Or, Lord of Heroes if thou aid the worshipper who shed; the, juice,

Sanskit Text: उक्थे वा यस्यरण्यसि समिन्दुभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukthe vā yasyaraṇyasi samindubhiḥ ||
Translation: Or him whose laud delights thee, and his flowing drops.

Sanskit Text: देवं-देवं वो.अवस इन्द्रम-इन्द्रं गर्णीषणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devaṃ-devaṃ vo.avasa indram-indraṃ ghṛṇīṣaṇi |
Translation: 19 To magnify the God, the God, Indra, yea, Indra for your help,

Sanskit Text: अधा यज्ञाय तुर्वणे वयानशुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā yajñāya turvaṇe vyānaśuḥ ||
Translation: And promptly end the sacrifice-this have they gained.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञेभिर्यज्ञवाहसं सोमेभिः सोमपातमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñebhiryajñavāhasaṃ somebhiḥ somapātamam |
Translation: 20 With worship, him whom men adore, with Soma, him who drinks it most,

Sanskit Text: होत्राभिरिन्द्रं वाव्र्धुर्व्यानशुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotrābhirindraṃ vāvṛdhurvyānaśuḥ ||
Translation: Indra with lauds have they increasedthis have they gained.

Sanskit Text: महीरस्य परणीतयः पूर्वीरुत परशस्तयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahīrasya praṇītayaḥ pūrvīruta praśastayaḥ |
Translation: 21 His leadings are with power and might and his instructions manifold:

Sanskit Text: विश्वा वसूनि दाशुषे वयानशुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā vasūni dāśuṣe vyānaśuḥ ||
Translation: He gives the worshipper all wealth: this have they gained.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं वर्त्राय हन्तवे देवासो दधिरे पुरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ vṛtrāya hantave devāso dadhire puraḥ |
Translation: 22 For slaying Vṛtra have the Gods set Indra in the foremost place.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं वाणीरनूषता समोजसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ vāṇīranūṣatā samojase ||
Translation: Indra the choral bands have sung, for vigorous strength.

Sanskit Text: महान्तं महिना वयं सतोमेभिर्हवनश्रुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahāntaṃ mahinā vayaṃ stomebhirhavanaśrutam |
Translation: 23 We to the Mighty with our might, with lauds to him who hears our call,

Sanskit Text: अर्कैरभिप्र णोनुमः समोजसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arkairabhipra ṇonumaḥ samojase ||
Translation: With holy hymns have sung aloud, for vigorous strength.

Sanskit Text: न यं विविक्तो रोदसी नान्तरिक्षाणि वज्रिणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yaṃ vivikto rodasī nāntarikṣāṇi vajriṇam |
Translation: 24 Not earth, nor heaven, nor firmaments contain the Thunder-wielding God:

Sanskit Text: अमादिदस्य तित्विषे समोजसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: amādidasya titviṣe samojasaḥ ||
Translation: They shake before his violent rush and vigorous strength.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्र पर्तनाज्ये देवास्त्वा दधिरे पुरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindra pṛtanājye devāstvā dadhire puraḥ |
Translation: 25 What time the Gods, O Indra, get thee foremost in the furious fight,

Sanskit Text: आदित ते हर्यता हरी ववक्षतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādit te haryatā harī vavakṣatuḥ ||
Translation: Then thy two beautiful Bay Steeds carried thee on.

Sanskit Text: यदा वर्त्रं नदीव्र्तं शवसा वज्रिन्नवधीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā vṛtraṃ nadīvṛtaṃ śavasā vajrinnavadhīḥ |
Translation: 26 When Vṛtra, stayer of the floods, thou si"est, Thundeicr with might,

Sanskrit Transliteration: ādit te ... ||
Translation: Then thy two beautiful Bay Steeds carried thee on.

Sanskit Text: यदा ते विष्णुरोजसा तरीणि पदा विचक्रमे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā te viṣṇurojasā trīṇi padā vicakrame |
Translation: 27 When Viṣṇu, through thine energy, strode wide those three great steps of his,

Sanskrit Transliteration: ādit te . .. ||
Translation: Then thy two beautiful Bay Steeds carried thee on.

Sanskit Text: यदा ते हर्यता हरी वाव्र्धाते दिवे-दिवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā te haryatā harī vāvṛdhāte dive-dive |
Translation: 28 When thy two beautiful Bay Steeds grew great and greater day by day,

Sanskit Text: आदित ते विश्वा भुवनानि येमिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādit te viśvā bhuvanāni yemire ||
Translation: Even then all creatures that had life bowed down to thee.

Sanskit Text: यदा ते मारुतीर्विशस्तुभ्यमिन्द्र नियेमिरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā te mārutīrviśastubhyamindra niyemire |
Translation: 29 When, Indra, all the Marut folk humbly submitted them to thee,

Sanskit Text: आ इत ते व. ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā it te v. ... ||
Translation: Even then all creatures that had life bowed down to thee.

Sanskit Text: यदा सूर्यममुं दिवि शुक्रं जयोतिरधारयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā sūryamamuṃ divi śukraṃ jyotiradhārayaḥ |
Translation: 30 When yonder Sun, that brilliant light, thou settest in the heaven above,

Sanskrit Transliteration: āditte v. ... ||
Translation: Even then all creatures that had life bowed down to thee.

Sanskit Text: इमां त इन्द्र सुष्टुतिं विप्र इयर्ति धीतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imāṃ ta indra suṣṭutiṃ vipra iyarti dhītibhiḥ |
Translation: 31 To thee, O Indra, with this thought the sage lifts up this eulogy,

Sanskit Text: जामिं पदेव पिप्रतीं पराध्वरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jāmiṃ padeva pipratīṃ prādhvare ||
Translation: Akin and leading as on foot to sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: यदस्य धामनि परिये समीचीनासो अस्वरन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadasya dhāmani priye samīcīnāso asvaran |
Translation: 32 When in thine own dear dwelling all gathered have lifted up the voice

Sanskit Text: नाभा यज्ञस्य दोहना पराध्वरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nābhā yajñasya dohanā prādhvare ||
Translation: Milk-streams at worship's central spot, for sacrifice,

Sanskit Text: सुवीर्यं सवश्व्यं सुगव्यं इन्द्र दद्धि नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvīryaṃ svaśvyaṃ sughavyaṃ indra daddhi naḥ |
Translation: 33 As Priest, O Indra, give us wealth in brave men and good steeds ana kine

Sanskit Text: होतेव पूर्वचित्तये पराध्वरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hoteva pūrvacittaye prādhvare ||
Translation: That we may first remember thee for sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रः सुतेषु सोमेषु करतुं पुनीत उक्थ्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraḥ suteṣu someṣu kratuṃ punīta ukthyam |
Translation: 1. INDRA, when Soma juices flow, makes his mind pure and meet for lauds.

Sanskit Text: विदे वर्धस्यदक्षसो महान हि षः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vide vṛdhasyadakṣaso mahān hi ṣaḥ ||
Translation: He gains the power that brings success, for great is he.

Sanskit Text: स परथमे वयोमनि देवानां सदने वर्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa prathame vyomani devānāṃ sadane vṛdhaḥ |
Translation: 2 In heaven's first region, in the seat of Gods, is he who brings success,

Sanskit Text: सुपारः सुश्रवस्तमः समप्सुजित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: supāraḥ suśravastamaḥ samapsujit ||
Translation: Most glorious, prompt to save, who wins the water-floods.

Sanskit Text: तमह्वे वाजसातय इन्द्रं भराय शुष्मिणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamahve vājasātaya indraṃ bharāya śuṣmiṇam |
Translation: 3 Him, to win strength, have I invoked, even Indra mighty for the fray.

Sanskit Text: भवा नःसुम्ने अन्तमः सखा वर्धे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhavā naḥsumne antamaḥ sakhā vṛdhe ||
Translation: Be thou most near to us for bliss, a Friend to aid.

Sanskit Text: इयं त इन्द्र गिर्वणो रातिः कषरति सुन्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyaṃ ta indra ghirvaṇo rātiḥ kṣarati sunvataḥ |
Translation: 4 Indra, Song -lover, here for thee the worshipper's libation flows.

Sanskit Text: मन्दानो अस्य बर्हिषो वि राजसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mandāno asya barhiṣo vi rājasi ||
Translation: Rejoicing in this sacred grass thou shinest forth.

Sanskit Text: नूनं तदिन्द्र दद्धि नो यत तवा सुन्वन्त ईमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nūnaṃ tadindra daddhi no yat tvā sunvanta īmahe |
Translation: 5 Even now, O Indra, give us that which, pressing juice, we crave of thee.

Sanskit Text: रयिं नश्चित्रमा भरा सवर्विदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rayiṃ naścitramā bharā svarvidam ||
Translation: Bring us wealth manifold which finds the light of heaven.

Sanskit Text: सतोता यत ते विचर्षणिरतिप्रशर्धयद गिरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stotā yat te vicarṣaṇiratipraśardhayad ghiraḥ |
Translation: 6 What time the zealous worshipper hath boldly sung his songs to thee,

Sanskit Text: वया इवानु रोहते जुषन्त यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayā ivānu rohate juṣanta yat ||
Translation: Like branches of a tree up-grows what they desire.

Sanskit Text: परत्नवज्जनया गिरः शर्णुधी जरितुर्हवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratnavajjanayā ghiraḥ śṛṇudhī jariturhavam |
Translation: 7 Generate songs even as of old, give car unto the singer's call.

Sanskit Text: मदे-मदे ववक्षिथा सुक्र्त्वने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: made-made vavakṣithā sukṛtvane ||
Translation: Thou for the pious hast grown great at each carouse.

Sanskit Text: करीळन्त्यस्य सून्र्ता आपो न परवता यतीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: krīḷantyasya sūnṛtā āpo na pravatā yatīḥ |
Translation: 8 Sweet strains that glorify him play like waters speeding down a slope,

Sanskit Text: अया धिया य उच्यते पतिर्दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayā dhiyā ya ucyate patirdivaḥ ||
Translation: Yea, him who in this song is called the Lord of Heaven;

Sanskit Text: उतो पतिर्य उच्यते कर्ष्टीनामेक इद वशी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto patirya ucyate kṛṣṭīnāmeka id vaśī |
Translation: 9 Yea, who alone is called the Lord, the single Ruler of the folk,

Sanskit Text: नमोव्र्धैरवस्युभिः सुते रण ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: namovṛdhairavasyubhiḥ sute raṇa ||
Translation: By worshippers seeking aid: may he joy in the draught.

Sanskit Text: सतुहि शरुतं विपश्चितं हरी यस्य परसक्षिणा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stuhi śrutaṃ vipaścitaṃ harī yasya prasakṣiṇā |
Translation: 10 Praise him, the Glorious, skilled in song, Lord of the two victorious Bays:

Sanskit Text: गन्तारा दाशुषो गर्हं नमस्विनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghantārā dāśuṣo ghṛhaṃ namasvinaḥ ||
Translation: They seek the worshipper's abode who bows in prayer.

Sanskit Text: तूतुजानो महेमते.अश्वेभिः परुषितप्सुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tūtujāno mahemate.aśvebhiḥ pruṣitapsubhiḥ |
Translation: 11 Put forth thy strength: with dappled Steeds come, thou of mighty intellect,

Sanskit Text: आ याहि यज्ञमाशुभिः शमिद धि ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yāhi yajñamāśubhiḥ śamid dhi te ||
Translation: With swift Steeds to the sacrifice, for ’tis thy joy.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र शविष्ठ सत्पते रयिं गर्णत्सु धारय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra śaviṣṭha satpate rayiṃ ghṛṇatsu dhāraya |
Translation: 12 Grant wealth to those who praise thee, Lord of Heroes, Mightiest Indra: give

Sanskit Text: शरवः सूरिभ्यो अम्र्तं वसुत्वनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śravaḥ sūribhyo amṛtaṃ vasutvanam ||
Translation: Our princes everlasting fame and opulence.

Sanskit Text: हवे तवा सूर उदिते हवे मध्यन्दिने दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: have tvā sūra udite have madhyandine divaḥ |
Translation: 13 I call thee when the Sun is risen, I call thee at the noon of day:

Sanskit Text: जुषाण इन्द्र सप्तिभिर्न आ गहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣāṇa indra saptibhirna ā ghahi ||
Translation: With thy car-horses, Indra, come wellpleased to us.

Sanskit Text: आ तू गहि पर तु दरव मत्स्वा सुतस्य गोमतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tū ghahi pra tu drava matsvā sutasya ghomataḥ |
Translation: 14 Speed forward hither, come to us, rejoice thee in the milky draught:

Sanskit Text: तन्तुं तनुष्व पूर्व्यं यथा विदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tantuṃ tanuṣva pūrvyaṃ yathā vide ||
Translation: Spin out the thread of ancient time, as well is known.

Sanskit Text: यच्छक्रासि परावति यदर्वावति वर्त्रहन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yacchakrāsi parāvati yadarvāvati vṛtrahan |
Translation: 15 If, Śakra, Vṛtra-slayer, thou be far away or near to us.

Sanskit Text: यद वा समुद्रे अन्धसो.अवितेदसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā samudre andhaso.avitedasi ||
Translation: Or in the sea, thou art the guard of Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं वर्धन्तु नो गिर इन्द्रं सुतास इन्दवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ vardhantu no ghira indraṃ sutāsa indavaḥ |
Translation: 16 Let songs we sing and Soma-drops expressed by us make Indra strong:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रे हविष्मतीर्विशो अराणिषुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indre haviṣmatīrviśo arāṇiṣuḥ ||
Translation: The tribes who bring oblations find delight in him.

Sanskit Text: तमिद विप्रा अवस्यवः परवत्वतीभिरूतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamid viprā avasyavaḥ pravatvatībhirūtibhiḥ |
Translation: 17 Him sages longing for his aid, with offerings brought in eager haste,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं कषोणीरवर्धयन वया इव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ kṣoṇīravardhayan vayā iva ||
Translation: Him. even as branches, all mankind have made to grow.

Sanskit Text: तरिकद्रुकेषु चेतनं देवासो यज्ञमत्नत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trikadrukeṣu cetanaṃ devāso yajñamatnata |
Translation: 18 At the Trkadrukas the Gods span sacrifice that stirred the mind:

Sanskit Text: तमिद वर्धन्तुनो गिरः सदाव्र्धम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamid vardhantuno ghiraḥ sadāvṛdham ||
Translation: May our songs strengthen him who still hath strengthened us.

Sanskit Text: सतोता यत ते अनुव्रत उक्थान्य रतुथा दधे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stotā yat te anuvrata ukthāny ṛtuthā dadhe |
Translation: 19 When, true to duty, at due times the worshipper offers lauds to thee,

Sanskit Text: शुचिः पावक उच्यते सो अद्भुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuciḥ pāvaka ucyate so adbhutaḥ ||
Translation: They call him Purifier, Pure, and Wonderful.

Sanskit Text: तदिद रुद्रस्य चेतति यह्वं परत्नेषु धामसु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadid rudrasya cetati yahvaṃ pratneṣu dhāmasu |
Translation: 20 That mind of Rudra, fresh and strong, moves conscious in the ancient ways,

Sanskit Text: मनो यत्रावि तद दधुर्विचेतसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mano yatrāvi tad dadhurvicetasaḥ ||
Translation: With reference whereto the wise have ordered this.

Sanskit Text: यदि मे सख्यमावर इमस्य पाह्यन्धसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadi me sakhyamāvara imasya pāhyandhasaḥ |
Translation: 21 If thou elect to be my Friend drink of this sacrificial juice,

Sanskit Text: येन विश्वा अति दविषो अतारिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena viśvā ati dviṣo atārima ||
Translation: By help whereof we may subdue all enemies.

Sanskit Text: कदा त इन्द्र गिर्वण सतोता भवाति शन्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadā ta indra ghirvaṇa stotā bhavāti śantamaḥ |
Translation: 22 O Indra, Lover of the song, when shall thy praiser be most blest?

Sanskit Text: कदा नो गव्ये अश्व्ये वसौ दधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadā no ghavye aśvye vasau dadhaḥ ||
Translation: When wilt thou grant us wealth in herds of kine and steeds?

Sanskit Text: उत ते सुष्टुता हरी वर्षणा वहतो रथम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta te suṣṭutā harī vṛṣaṇā vahato ratham |
Translation: 23 And thy two highIy-lauded Bays, strong stallions, draw thy car who art

Sanskit Text: अजुर्यस्य मदिन्तमं यमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajuryasya madintamaṃ yamīmahe ||
Translation: Untouched by age, most gladdening car for which we pray.

Sanskit Text: तमीमहे पुरुष्टुतं यह्वं परत्नाभिरूतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamīmahe puruṣṭutaṃ yahvaṃ pratnābhirūtibhiḥ |
Translation: 24 With ancient offerings we implore the Young and Strong whom many praise.

Sanskit Text: नि बर्हिषि परिये सददध दविता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni barhiṣi priye sadadadha dvitā ||
Translation: He from of old hath sat upon dear sacred grass.

Sanskit Text: वर्धस्वा सु पुरुष्टुत रषिष्टुताभिरूतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vardhasvā su puruṣṭuta ṛṣiṣṭutābhirūtibhiḥ |
Translation: 25 Wax miglity, thou whom many laud for aids which Ṛṣis have extolled.

Sanskit Text: धुक्षस्वपिप्युषीमिषमवा च नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhukṣasvapipyuṣīmiṣamavā ca naḥ ||
Translation: Pour down for us abundant food and guard us well.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र तवमवितेदसीत्था सतुवतो अद्रिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra tvamavitedasītthā stuvato adrivaḥ |
Translation: 26 O Indra, Caster of the Stone, thou helpest him who praises thee:

Sanskit Text: रतादियर्मि ते धियं मनोयुजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtādiyarmi te dhiyaṃ manoyujam ||
Translation: From sacrifice I send to thee a mindyoked hymn.

Sanskit Text: इह तया सधमाद्य युजानः सोमपीतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iha tyā sadhamādya yujānaḥ somapītaye |
Translation: 27 Here, yoking for the Soma-draught these Horses, sharers of thy feast,

Sanskit Text: हरी इन्द्र परतद्वसू अभि सवर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: harī indra pratadvasū abhi svara ||
Translation: Thy Bay Steeds, Indra, fraught with weal tb, consent to come.

Sanskit Text: अभि सवरन्तु ये तव रुद्रासः सक्षत शरियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi svarantu ye tava rudrāsaḥ sakṣata śriyam |
Translation: 28 Attendants on thy glory, let the Rudras roar assent to thee,

Sanskit Text: उतो मरुत्वतीर्विशो अभि परयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto marutvatīrviśo abhi prayaḥ ||
Translation: And all the Marut companies come tothe feast.

Sanskit Text: इमा अस्य परतूर्तयः पदं जुषन्त यद दिवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā asya pratūrtayaḥ padaṃ juṣanta yad divi |
Translation: 29 These his victorious followers bold in the heavens the place they love,

Sanskit Text: नाभा यज्ञस्य सं दधुर्यथा विदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nābhā yajñasya saṃ dadhuryathā vide ||
Translation: Leagued in the heart of sacrifice, as well we know.

Sanskit Text: अयं दीर्घाय चक्षसे पराचि परयत्यध्वरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ dīrghāya cakṣase prāci prayatyadhvare |
Translation: 30 That we may long behold the light, what time the ordered rite proceeds,

Sanskit Text: मिमीते यज्ञमानुषग विचक्ष्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mimīte yajñamānuṣagh vicakṣya ||
Translation: He duly measures, as he views, the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: वर्षायमिन्द्र ते रथ उतो ते वर्षणा हरी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣāyamindra te ratha uto te vṛṣaṇā harī |
Translation: 31 O Indra, strong is this thy car, and strong are these Bay Steeds of thine:

Sanskit Text: वर्षा तवंशतक्रतो वर्षा हवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā tvaṃśatakrato vṛṣā havaḥ ||
Translation: O Śatakratu, thou art strong, strong is our call.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा गरावा वर्षा मदो वर्षा सोमो अयं सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā ghrāvā vṛṣā mado vṛṣā somo ayaṃ sutaḥ |
Translation: 32 Strong is the press-stone, strong thy joy, strong is the flowing Soma juice:

Sanskit Text: वर्षायज्ञो यमिन्वसि वर्षा हवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣāyajño yaminvasi vṛṣā havaḥ ||
Translation: Strong is the rite thou furtherest, strong is our call.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा तवा वर्षणं हुवे वज्रिञ्चित्राभिरुतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇaṃ huve vajriñcitrābhirutibhiḥ |
Translation: 33 As strong I call on thee the Strong, O Thunderer with thy thousand aids:

Sanskit Text: वावन्थ हि परतिष्टुतिं वर्षा हवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāvantha hi pratiṣṭutiṃ vṛṣā havaḥ ||
Translation: For thou hast won the hymn of praise. Strong is our call.

Sanskit Text: तं वभि पर गायत पुरुहूतं पुरुष्टुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vabhi pra ghāyata puruhūtaṃ puruṣṭutam |
Translation: 1. SING forth to him whom many men invoke, to him whom many laud.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं गीर्भिस्तविषमा विवासत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ ghīrbhistaviṣamā vivāsata ||
Translation: Invite the powerful Indra with your songs of praise.

Sanskit Text: यस्य दविबर्हसो बर्हत सहो दाधार रोदसी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya dvibarhaso bṛhat saho dādhāra rodasī |
Translation: 2 Whose lofty might-for doubly strong is he-supports the heavens and earth,

Sanskit Text: गिरीन्रज्रानपः सवर्व्र्षत्वना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghirīnrajrānapaḥ svarvṛṣatvanā ||
Translation: And hills and plains and floods and light with manly power.

Sanskit Text: स राजसि पुरुष्टुत एको वर्त्राणि जिघ्नसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa rājasi puruṣṭuta eko vṛtrāṇi jighnase |
Translation: 3 Such, Praised by many! thou art King alone thou smitest Vṛtras dead,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र जैत्रा शरवस्या च यन्तवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra jaitrā śravasyā ca yantave ||
Translation: To gain, O Indra, spoils of war and high renown.

Sanskit Text: तं ते मदं गर्णीमसि वर्षणं पर्त्सु सासहिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ te madaṃ ghṛṇīmasi vṛṣaṇaṃ pṛtsu sāsahim |
Translation: 4 We sing this strong and wild delight of thine which conquers in the fray,

Sanskit Text: उ लोकक्र्त्नुमद्रिवो हरिश्रियम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: u lokakṛtnumadrivo hariśriyam ||
Translation: Which, Caster of the Stone! gives room and shines like gold.

Sanskit Text: येन जयोतींष्यायवे मनवे च विवेदिथ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena jyotīṃṣyāyave manave ca viveditha |
Translation: 5 Wherewith thou also foundest lights for Āyu and for Manu's sake:

Sanskit Text: मन्दानो अस्य बर्हिषो वि राजसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mandāno asya barhiṣo vi rājasi ||
Translation: Now joying in this sacred grass thou beamest forth.

Sanskit Text: तदद्या चित त उक्थिनो.अनु षटुवन्ति पूर्वथा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadadyā cit ta ukthino.anu ṣṭuvanti pūrvathā |
Translation: 6 This day too singers of the hymn praise, as of old, this might of thine:

Sanskit Text: वर्षपत्नीरपो जया दिवे-दिवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣapatnīrapo jayā dive-dive ||
Translation: Win thou the waters day by day, thralls of the strong.

Sanskit Text: तव तयदिन्द्रियं बर्हत तव शुष्ममुत करतुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava tyadindriyaṃ bṛhat tava śuṣmamuta kratum |
Translation: 7 That lofty Indra-power of thine, thy strength and thine intelligence,

Sanskit Text: वज्रं शिशाति धिषणा वरेण्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vajraṃ śiśāti dhiṣaṇā vareṇyam ||
Translation: Thy thunderbolt for which we long, the wish makes keen.

Sanskit Text: तव दयौरिन्द्र पौंस्यं पर्थिवी वर्धति शरवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava dyaurindra pauṃsyaṃ pṛthivī vardhati śravaḥ |
Translation: 8 O Indra, Heaven and Earth augment thy manly power and thy renown;

Sanskit Text: तवामापः पर्वतासश्च हिन्विरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmāpaḥ parvatāsaśca hinvire ||
Translation: The waters and thy mountains stir and urge thee on.

Sanskit Text: तवां विष्णुर्ब्र्हन कषयो मित्रो गर्णाति वरुणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ viṣṇurbṛhan kṣayo mitro ghṛṇāti varuṇaḥ |
Translation: 9 Viṣṇu the lofty ruling Power, Varuṇa, Mitra sing thy praise:

Sanskit Text: तवांशर्धो मदत्यनु मारुतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃśardho madatyanu mārutam ||
Translation: In thee the Marut3' company have great delight.

Sanskit Text: तवं वर्षा जनानां मंहिष्ठ इन्द्र जज्ञिषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ vṛṣā janānāṃ maṃhiṣṭha indra jajñiṣe |
Translation: 10 O Indra, thou wast born the Lord of men, most liberal of thy gifts:

Sanskit Text: सत्रा विश्वा सवपत्यानि दधिषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satrā viśvā svapatyāni dadhiṣe ||
Translation: Excellent deeds for evermore are all thine own.

Sanskit Text: सत्रा तवं पुरुष्टुत एको वर्त्राणि तोशसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satrā tvaṃ puruṣṭuta eko vṛtrāṇi tośase |
Translation: 11 Ever, alone, O highly-praised, thou sendest Vṛtras to their rest:

Sanskit Text: नान्य इन्द्रात्करणं भूय इन्वति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nānya indrātkaraṇaṃ bhūya invati ||
Translation: None else than Indra executes the mighty deed.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्र मन्मशस्त्वा नाना हवन्त ऊतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindra manmaśastvā nānā havanta ūtaye |
Translation: 12 Though here and there, in varied hymns, Indra, men call on thee for aid,

Sanskit Text: अस्माकेभिर्न्र्भिरत्रा सवर्जय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākebhirnṛbhiratrā svarjaya ||
Translation: Still with our heroes fight and win the light of heaven.

Sanskit Text: अरं कषयाय नो महे विश्वा रूपाण्याविशन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: araṃ kṣayāya no mahe viśvā rūpāṇyāviśan |
Translation: 13 Already have all forms of him entered our spacious dwelling-place:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं जैत्राय हर्षया शचीपतिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ jaitrāya harṣayā śacīpatim ||
Translation: For victory stir thou Indra, up, the Lord of Might.

Sanskit Text: पर सम्राजं चर्षणीनामिन्द्रं सतोता नव्यं गीर्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra samrājaṃ carṣaṇīnāmindraṃ stotā navyaṃ ghīrbhiḥ |
Translation: 1. PRAISE Indra whom our songs must laud, sole Sovran of mankind, the Chief

Sanskit Text: नरं नर्षाहं मंहिष्ठम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: naraṃ nṛṣāhaṃ maṃhiṣṭham ||
Translation: Most liberal who controlleth men.

Sanskit Text: यस्मिन्नुक्थानि रण्यन्ति विश्वानि च शरवस्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasminnukthāni raṇyanti viśvāni ca śravasyā |
Translation: 2 In whom the hymns of praise delight, and all the glory-giving songs.

Sanskit Text: अपामवोन समुद्रे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāmavona samudre ||
Translation: Like the floods' longing for the sea.

Sanskit Text: तं सुष्टुत्या विवासे जयेष्ठराजं भरे कर्त्नुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ suṣṭutyā vivāse jyeṣṭharājaṃ bhare kṛtnum |
Translation: 3 Him I invite with eulogy, best King, effective in the fight,

Sanskit Text: महो वाजिनं सनिभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maho vājinaṃ sanibhyaḥ ||
Translation: Strong for the gain of mighty spoil.

Sanskit Text: यस्यानूना गभीरा मदा उरवस्तरुत्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasyānūnā ghabhīrā madā uravastarutrāḥ |
Translation: 4 Whose perfect ecstasies are wide, profound, victorious, and give

Sanskit Text: हर्षुमन्तःशूरसातौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: harṣumantaḥśūrasātau ||
Translation: joy in the field where heroes win.

Sanskit Text: तमिद धनेषु हितेष्वधिवाकाय हवन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamid dhaneṣu hiteṣvadhivākāya havante |
Translation: 5 Him, when the spoils of war are staked, men call to be their advocate:

Sanskit Text: येषामिन्द्रस्ते जयन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yeṣāmindraste jayanti ||
Translation: They who have Indra win the day.

Sanskit Text: तमिच्च्यौत्नैरार्यन्ति तं कर्तेभिश्चर्षणयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamiccyautnairāryanti taṃ kṛtebhiścarṣaṇayaḥ |
Translation: 6 Men honour him with stirring songs and magnify with solemn rites:

Sanskit Text: एषैन्द्रो वरिवस्क्र्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣaindro varivaskṛt ||
Translation: Indra is he who giveth case.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो बरह्मेन्द्र रषिरिन्द्रः पुरू पुरुहूतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro brahmendra ṛṣirindraḥ purū puruhūtaḥ |
Translation: 7 Indra is priest and Ṛṣi, he is much invoked by many men,

Sanskit Text: महान महीभिः शचीभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahān mahībhiḥ śacībhiḥ ||
Translation: And mighty by his mighty powers.

Sanskit Text: स सतोम्यः स हव्यः सत्यः सत्वा तुविकूर्मिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa stomyaḥ sa havyaḥ satyaḥ satvā tuvikūrmiḥ |
Translation: 8 Meet to be lauded and invoked, true Hero with his deeds of might,

Sanskit Text: एकश्चित्सन्नभिभूतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ekaścitsannabhibhūtiḥ ||
Translation: Victorious even when alone.

Sanskit Text: तमर्केभिस्तं सामभिस्तं गायत्रैश्चर्षणयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamarkebhistaṃ sāmabhistaṃ ghāyatraiścarṣaṇayaḥ |
Translation: 9 The men, the people magnify that Indra with their Slina. songs,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं वर्धन्ति कषितयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ vardhanti kṣitayaḥ ||
Translation: With hymns and sacred eulogies

Sanskit Text: परणेतारं वस्यो अछा कर्तारं जयोतिः समत्सु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: praṇetāraṃ vasyo achā kartāraṃ jyotiḥ samatsu |
Translation: 10 Him who advances them to wealth, sends light to lead them in the war,

Sanskit Text: सासह्वांसं युधामित्रान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sāsahvāṃsaṃ yudhāmitrān ||
Translation: And quells their foemen in the fray.

Sanskit Text: स नः पप्रिः पारयाति सवस्ति नावा पुरुहूतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ papriḥ pārayāti svasti nāvā puruhūtaḥ |
Translation: 11 May he, the saviour much-invoked, may Indra bear us in a ship

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो विश्वा अति दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro viśvā ati dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: Safely beyond all enemies.

Sanskit Text: स तवं न इन्द्र वाजेभिर्दशस्या च गातुया च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvaṃ na indra vājebhirdaśasyā ca ghātuyā ca |
Translation: 12 As such, O Indra, honour us with gifts of booty, further us,

Sanskit Text: अछा चनः सुम्नं नेषि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā canaḥ sumnaṃ neṣi ||
Translation: And lead us to felicity.

Sanskit Text: आ याहि सुषुमा हि त इन्द्र सोमं पिबा इमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yāhi suṣumā hi ta indra somaṃ pibā imam |
Translation: 1. COME, we have pressed the juice for thee; O Indra, drink this Soma here

Sanskit Text: एदं बर्हिः सदो मम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: edaṃ barhiḥ sado mama ||
Translation: Sit thou on this my sacred grass.

Sanskit Text: आ तवा बरह्मयुजा हरी वहतामिन्द्र केशिना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tvā brahmayujā harī vahatāmindra keśinā |
Translation: 2 O Indra, let thy long-maned Bays, yoked by prayer, bring thee hitherward

Sanskit Text: उप बरह्मणि नः शर्णु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa brahmaṇi naḥ śṛṇu ||
Translation: Give car and listen to our prayers.

Sanskit Text: बरह्माणस्त्वा वयं युजा सोमपामिन्द्र सोमिनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmāṇastvā vayaṃ yujā somapāmindra sominaḥ |
Translation: 3 We Soma-bearing Brahmans call thee Soma-drinker with thy friend,

Sanskit Text: सुतावन्तो हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sutāvanto havāmahe ||
Translation: We, Indra, bringing Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: आ नो याहि सुतावतो.अस्माकं सुष्टुतीरुप |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no yāhi sutāvato.asmākaṃ suṣṭutīrupa |
Translation: 4 Come unto us who bring the juice, come unto this our eulogy,

Sanskit Text: पिबा सु शिप्रिन्नन्धसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibā su śiprinnandhasaḥ ||
Translation: Fair-visored! drink thou of the juice.

Sanskit Text: आ ते सिञ्चामि कुक्ष्योरनु गात्रा वि धावतु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā te siñcāmi kukṣyoranu ghātrā vi dhāvatu |
Translation: 5 I pour it down within thee, so through all thy members let it spread:

Sanskit Text: गर्भाय जिह्वया मधु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛbhāya jihvayā madhu ||
Translation: Take with. thy tongue the pleasant drink.

Sanskit Text: सवादुष टे अस्तु संसुदे मधुमान तन्वे तव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāduṣ ṭe astu saṃsude madhumān tanve tava |
Translation: 6 Sweet to thy body let it be, delicious be the savoury juice:

Sanskit Text: सोमः शमस्तु ते हर्दे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaḥ śamastu te hṛde ||
Translation: Sweet be the Soma to thine heart.

Sanskit Text: अयमु तवा विचर्षणे जनीरिवाभि संव्र्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayamu tvā vicarṣaṇe janīrivābhi saṃvṛtaḥ |
Translation: 7 Like women, let this Soma-draught, invested with its robe, approach,

Sanskit Text: पर सोम इन्द्र सर्पतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra soma indra sarpatu ||
Translation: O active Indra, close to thee.

Sanskit Text: तुविग्रीवो वपोदरः सुबाहुरन्धसो मदे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tuvighrīvo vapodaraḥ subāhurandhaso made |
Translation: 8 Indra, transported with the juice, vast in his bulk, strong in his neck

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो वर्त्राणि जिघ्नते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro vṛtrāṇi jighnate ||
Translation: And stout arms, smites the Vṛtras down.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र परेहि पुरस्त्वं विश्वस्येशान ओजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra prehi purastvaṃ viśvasyeśāna ojasā |
Translation: 9 O Indra, go thou forward, thou who rulest over all by might:

Sanskit Text: वर्त्राणि वर्त्रहञ जहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛtrāṇi vṛtrahañ jahi ||
Translation: Thou Vṛtra-slayer slay the fiends,

Sanskit Text: दीर्घस्ते अस्त्वङकुशो येना वसु परयछसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dīrghaste astvaṅkuśo yenā vasu prayachasi |
Translation: 10 Long be thy grasping-hook wherewith thou givest ample wealth to him

Sanskit Text: यजमानाय सुन्वते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajamānāya sunvate ||
Translation: Who sheds the juice and worships thee.

Sanskit Text: अयं त इन्द्र सोमो निपूतो अधि बर्हिषि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ ta indra somo nipūto adhi barhiṣi |
Translation: 11 Here, Indra, is thy Soma-draught, made pure upon the sacred grass:

Sanskit Text: एहीमस्य दरवापिब ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ehīmasya dravāpiba ||
Translation: Run hither, come and drink thereof.

Sanskit Text: शाचिगो शाचिपूजनायं रणाय ते सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śācigho śācipūjanāyaṃ raṇāya te sutaḥ |
Translation: 12 Famed for thy radiance, worshipped well this juice is shed for thy delight

Sanskit Text: आखण्डल पर हूयसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ākhaṇḍala pra hūyase ||
Translation: Thou art invoked, Akhandala!

Sanskit Text: यस्ते शर्ङगव्र्षो नपात परणपात कुण्डपाय्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaste śṛṅghavṛṣo napāt praṇapāt kuṇḍapāyyaḥ |
Translation: 13 To Kundapayya, grandson's son, grandson of Srngavrs! to thee,

Sanskit Text: नयस्मिन दध्र आ मनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nyasmin dadhra ā manaḥ ||
Translation: To him have I addressed my thought.

Sanskit Text: वास्तोष पते धरुवा सथूणांसत्रं सोम्यानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāstoṣ pate dhruvā sthūṇāṃsatraṃ somyānām |
Translation: 14 Strong pillar thou, Lord of the home armour of Soma-offerers:

Sanskit Text: दरप्सो भेत्ता पुरां शश्वतीनामिन्द्रो मुनीनां सखा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: drapso bhettā purāṃ śaśvatīnāmindro munīnāṃ sakhā ||
Translation: The drop of Soma breaketh all the strongholds down, and Indra is the Ṛṣis’ Friend.

Sanskit Text: पर्दाकुसानुर्यजतो गवेषण एकः सन्नभि भूयसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛdākusānuryajato ghaveṣaṇa ekaḥ sannabhi bhūyasaḥ |
Translation: 15 Holy Prdikusanu, winner of the spoil, one eminent o’er many men,

Sanskit Text: भूर्णिमश्वं नयत तुजा पुरो गर्भेन्द्रं सोमस्य पीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūrṇimaśvaṃ nayat tujā puro ghṛbhendraṃ somasya pītaye ||
Translation: Lead on the wild horse Indra with his vigorous grasp forward to drink the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: इदं ह नूनमेषां सुम्नं भिक्षेत मर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ ha nūnameṣāṃ sumnaṃ bhikṣeta martyaḥ |
Translation: 1. Now let the mortal offer prayer to win the unexampled grace

Sanskit Text: आदित्यानामपूर्व्यं सवीमनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityānāmapūrvyaṃ savīmani ||
Translation: Of these Ādityas and their aid to cherish life.

Sanskit Text: अनर्वाणो हयेषां पन्था आदित्यानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anarvāṇo hyeṣāṃ panthā ādityānām |
Translation: 2 For not an enemy molests the paths which these Ādityas tread:

Sanskit Text: अदब्धाः सन्ति पायवः सुगेव्र्धः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adabdhāḥ santi pāyavaḥ sughevṛdhaḥ ||
Translation: Infallible guards, they strengthen us in happiness.

Sanskit Text: तत सु नः सविता भगो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat su naḥ savitā bhagho varuṇo mitro aryamā |
Translation: 3 Now soon may Bhaga, Savitar, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman

Sanskit Text: शर्म यछन्तु सप्रथो यदीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śarma yachantu sapratho yadīmahe ||
Translation: Give us the shelter widely spread which we implore.

Sanskit Text: देवेभिर्देव्यदिते.अरिष्टभर्मन्ना गहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devebhirdevyadite.ariṣṭabharmannā ghahi |
Translation: 4 With Gods come thou whose fostering care none checks, O Goddesss Aditi:

Sanskit Text: समत सूरिभिः पुरुप्रिये सुशर्मभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: smat sūribhiḥ purupriye suśarmabhiḥ ||
Translation: Come, dear to many, with the Lords who guard us well.

Sanskit Text: ते हि पुत्रासो अदितेर्विदुर्द्वेषांसि योतवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te hi putrāso aditervidurdveṣāṃsi yotave |
Translation: 5 For well these Sons of Aditi know to keep enmities aloof,

Sanskit Text: अंहोश्चिदुरुचक्रयो.अनेहसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṃhościdurucakrayo.anehasaḥ ||
Translation: Unrivalled, giving ample room, they save from woe.

Sanskit Text: अदितिर्नो दिवा पशुमदितिर्नक्तमद्वयाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aditirno divā paśumaditirnaktamadvayāḥ |
Translation: 6 Aditi guard our herd by day, Aditi, free from guile, by night,

Sanskit Text: अदितिः पात्वंहसः सदाव्र्धा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aditiḥ pātvaṃhasaḥ sadāvṛdhā ||
Translation: Aditi, ever strengthening, save us from grief!

Sanskit Text: उत सया नो दिवा मतिरदितिरूत्या गमत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta syā no divā matiraditirūtyā ghamat |
Translation: 7 And in the day our hymn is this: May Aditi come nigh to help,

Sanskit Text: सा शन्ताति मयस करदप सरिधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā śantāti mayas karadapa sridhaḥ ||
Translation: With loving-kindness bring us weal and chase our foes.

Sanskit Text: उत तया दैव्या भिषजा शं नः करतो अश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tyā daivyā bhiṣajā śaṃ naḥ karato aśvinā |
Translation: 8 And may the Aśvins, the divine Pair of Physicians, send us health:

Sanskit Text: युयुयातामितो रपो अप सरिधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuyuyātāmito rapo apa sridhaḥ ||
Translation: May they remove iniquity and chase our foes.

Sanskit Text: शमग्निरग्निभिः करच्छं नस्तपतु सूर्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śamaghniraghnibhiḥ karacchaṃ nastapatu sūryaḥ |
Translation: 9 May Agni bless us with his fires, and Sūrya warm us pleasantly:

Sanskit Text: शं वातो वात्वरपा अप सरिधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ vāto vātvarapā apa sridhaḥ ||
Translation: May the pure Wind breathe sweet on us, and chase our foes.

Sanskit Text: अपामीवामप सरिधमप सेधत दुर्मतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāmīvāmapa sridhamapa sedhata durmatim |
Translation: 10 Drive ye disease and strife away, drive ye away malignity:

Sanskit Text: आदित्यासो युयोतना नो अंहसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityāso yuyotanā no aṃhasaḥ ||
Translation: Ādityas, keep us ever far from sore distress.

Sanskit Text: युयोता शरुमस्मदानादित्यास उतामतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuyotā śarumasmadānādityāsa utāmatim |
Translation: 11 Remove from us the arrow, keep famine, Ādityas! far away:

Sanskit Text: रधग दवेषःक्र्णुत विश्ववेदसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛdhagh dveṣaḥkṛṇuta viśvavedasaḥ ||
Translation: Keep enmities afar from us, Lords of all wealth!

Sanskit Text: तत सु नः शर्म यछतादित्या यन मुमोचति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat su naḥ śarma yachatādityā yan mumocati |
Translation: 12 Now, O Ādityas, grant to us the shelter that lets man go free,

Sanskit Text: एनस्वन्तं चिदेनसः सुदानवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: enasvantaṃ cidenasaḥ sudānavaḥ ||
Translation: Yea, even the sinner from his sin, ye Bounteous Gods 1

Sanskit Text: यो नः कश्चिद रिरिक्षति रक्षस्त्वेन मर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo naḥ kaścid ririkṣati rakṣastvena martyaḥ |
Translation: 13 Whatever mortal with the powe r of demons fain would injure us,

Sanskit Text: सवैः षेवै रिरिषीष्ट युर्जनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svaiḥ ṣaevai ririṣīṣṭa yurjanaḥ ||
Translation: May he, impetuous, suffer harm by his own deeds.

Sanskit Text: समित तमघमश्नवद दुःशंसं मर्त्यं रिपुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samit tamaghamaśnavad duḥśaṃsaṃ martyaṃ ripum |
Translation: 14 May sin o’ertake our human foe, the man who speaketh evil thing,

Sanskit Text: यो अस्मत्रा दुर्हणावानुप दवयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo asmatrā durhaṇāvānupa dvayuḥ ||
Translation: Him who would cause our misery, whose heart is false.

Sanskit Text: पाकत्रा सथन देवा हर्त्सु जानीथ मर्त्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pākatrā sthana devā hṛtsu jānītha martyam |
Translation: 15 Gods, ye are with the simple ones, ye know each mortal in your hearts;

Sanskit Text: उप दवयुं चाद्वयुं च वसवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa dvayuṃ cādvayuṃ ca vasavaḥ ||
Translation: Ye, Vasus, well discriminate the false and true.

Sanskit Text: आ शर्म पर्वतानामोतापां वर्णीमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā śarma parvatānāmotāpāṃ vṛṇīmahe |
Translation: 16 Fain would we have the sheltering aid of mountains and of water-floods:

Sanskit Text: दयावाक्षामारे अस्मद रपस कर्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyāvākṣāmāre asmad rapas kṛtam ||
Translation: Keep far from us iniquity, O Heaven and Earth.

Sanskit Text: ते नो भद्रेण शर्मणा युष्माकं नावा वसवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te no bhadreṇa śarmaṇā yuṣmākaṃ nāvā vasavaḥ |
Translation: 17 So with auspicious sheltering aid do ye, O Vasus, carry us

Sanskit Text: अति विश्वानि दुरिता पिपर्तन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ati viśvāni duritā pipartana ||
Translation: Beyond all trouble and distress, borne in your ship.

Sanskit Text: तुचे तनाय तत सु नो दराघीय आयुर्जीवसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tuce tanāya tat su no drāghīya āyurjīvase |
Translation: 18 Ādityas, ye Most Mighty Ones, grant to our children and their seed

Sanskit Text: आदित्यासःसुमहसः कर्णोतन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityāsaḥsumahasaḥ kṛṇotana ||
Translation: Extended term of life that they may live long days.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञो हीळो वो अन्तर आदित्या अस्ति मर्ळत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajño hīḷo vo antara ādityā asti mṛḷata |
Translation: 19 Sacrifice, O Ādityas, is your inward monitor: be kind,

Sanskit Text: युष्मे इद वो अपि षमसि सजात्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣme id vo api ṣmasi sajātye ||
Translation: For in the bond of kindred we are bound to you.

Sanskit Text: बर्हद वरूथं मरुतां देवं तरातारमश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhad varūthaṃ marutāṃ devaṃ trātāramaśvinā |
Translation: 20 The Maruts’ high protecting aid, the Aśvins, and the God who saves,

Sanskit Text: मित्रमीमहे वरुणं सवस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitramīmahe varuṇaṃ svastaye ||
Translation: Mitra and Varuṇa for weal we supplicate.

Sanskit Text: अनेहो मित्रार्यमन नर्वद वरुण शंस्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aneho mitrāryaman nṛvad varuṇa śaṃsyam |
Translation: 21 Grant us a home with triple guard, Aryaman, Mitra, Varuṇa!

Sanskit Text: तरिवरूथं मरुतो यन्त नश्छर्दिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trivarūthaṃ maruto yanta naśchardiḥ ||
Translation: Unthreatened, Maruts! meet for praise, and filled with men.

Sanskit Text: ये चिद धि मर्त्युबन्धव आदित्या मनवः समसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye cid dhi mṛtyubandhava ādityā manavaḥ smasi |
Translation: 22 And as we human beings, O Ādityas, are akin to death,

Sanskit Text: पर सू नायुर्जीवसे तिरेतन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sū naāyurjīvase tiretana ||
Translation: Graciously lengthen ye our lives that we may live.

Sanskit Text: तं गूर्धया सवर्णरं देवासो देवमरतिं दधन्विरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ ghūrdhayā svarṇaraṃ devāso devamaratiṃ dadhanvire |
Translation: 1. SING praise to hiin, the Lord of Light. The Gods have made the God to be their messenger,

Sanskit Text: देवत्रा हव्यमोहिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devatrā havyamohire ||
Translation: And sent oblation to Gods.

Sanskit Text: विभूतरातिं विप्र चित्रशोचिषमग्निमीळिष्व यन्तुरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vibhūtarātiṃ vipra citraśociṣamaghnimīḷiṣva yanturam |
Translation: 2 Agni, the Bounteous Giver, bright with varied flames, laud thou, O singer Sobhari-

Sanskit Text: अस्य मेधस्य सोम्यस्य सोभरे परेमध्वराय पूर्व्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya medhasya somyasya sobhare premadhvarāya pūrvyam ||
Translation: Him who controls this sacred food with Soma blent, who hath first claim to sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: यजिष्ठं तवा वव्र्महे देवं देवत्रा होतारममर्त्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajiṣṭhaṃ tvā vavṛmahe devaṃ devatrā hotāramamartyam |
Translation: 3 Thee have we chosen skilftillest in sacrifice, Immortal Priest among the Gods,

Sanskit Text: अस्य यज्ञस्य सुक्रतुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya yajñasya sukratum ||
Translation: Wise finisher of this holy rite:

Sanskit Text: ऊर्जो नपातं सुभगं सुदीदितिमग्निं शरेष्ठशोचिषम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrjo napātaṃ subhaghaṃ sudīditimaghniṃ śreṣṭhaśociṣam |
Translation: 4 The Son of Strength, the blessed, brightly shining One, Agni whose light is excellent.

Sanskit Text: स नो मित्रस्य वरुणस्य सो अपामा सुम्नं यक्षते दिवि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no mitrasya varuṇasya so apāmā sumnaṃ yakṣate divi ||
Translation: May be by sacrifice win us in heaven the grace of Mitra, Varuṇa, and the Floods.

Sanskit Text: यः समिधा य आहुती यो वेदेन ददाश मर्तो अग्नये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ samidhā ya āhutī yo vedena dadāśa marto aghnaye |
Translation: 5 The mortal who hath ministered to Agni with oblation, fuel, ritual lore,

Sanskit Text: यो नमसा सवध्वरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo namasā svadhvaraḥ ||
Translation: And reverence, skilled in sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: तस्येदर्वन्तो रंहयन्त आशवस्तस्य दयुम्नितमं यशः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasyedarvanto raṃhayanta āśavastasya dyumnitamaṃ yaśaḥ |
Translation: 6 Verily swift to run are his fleet-footed steeds, and most resplendent fame is his.

Sanskit Text: न तमंहो देवक्र्तं कुतश्चन न मर्त्यक्र्तं नशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na tamaṃho devakṛtaṃ kutaścana na martyakṛtaṃ naśat ||
Translation: No trouble caused by Gods or wrought by mortal man from any side o’ertaketh him.

Sanskit Text: सवग्नयो वो अग्निभिः सयाम सूनो सहस ऊर्जां पते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svaghnayo vo aghnibhiḥ syāma sūno sahasa ūrjāṃ pate |
Translation: 7 May we by thine own fires be well supplied with fire, O Son of Strength, O Lord of Might:

Sanskit Text: सुवीरस्त्वमस्मयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvīrastvamasmayuḥ ||
Translation: Thou as our Friend hast worthy men.

Sanskit Text: परशंसमानो अतिथिर्न मित्रियो.अग्नी रथो न वेद्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: praśaṃsamāno atithirna mitriyo.aghnī ratho na vedyaḥ |
Translation: 8 Agni, who praises like a guest of friendly mind, is as a car that brings us gear.

Sanskit Text: तवे कषेमासो अपि सन्ति साधवस्त्वं राजा रयीणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve kṣemāso api santi sādhavastvaṃ rājā rayīṇām ||
Translation: Also in thee is found perfect security thou art the Sovran Lord of wealth.

Sanskit Text: सो अद्धा दाश्वध्वरो.अग्ने मर्तः सुभग स परशंस्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: so addhā dāśvadhvaro.aghne martaḥ subhagha sa praśaṃsyaḥ |
Translation: 9 That man, moreover, merits praise who brings, auspicious Agni, sacrificial gifts

Sanskit Text: स धीभिरस्तु सनिता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa dhībhirastu sanitā ||
Translation: May he win riches by his thoughts.

Sanskit Text: यस्य तवमूर्ध्वो अध्वराय तिष्ठसि कषयद्वीरः स साधते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya tvamūrdhvo adhvarāya tiṣṭhasi kṣayadvīraḥ sa sādhate |
Translation: 10 He for whose sacrifice thou standest up erect is prosperous and rules o’er men.

Sanskit Text: सो अर्वद्भिः सनिता स विपन्युभिः स शूरैः सनिता कर्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: so arvadbhiḥ sanitā sa vipanyubhiḥ sa śūraiḥ sanitā kṛtam ||
Translation: He wins with coursers and with singers killed in song: with heroes he obtains the prize.

Sanskit Text: यस्याग्निर्वपुर्ग्र्हे सतोमं चनो दधीत विश्ववार्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasyāghnirvapurghṛhe stomaṃ cano dadhīta viśvavāryaḥ |
Translation: 11 He in whose dwelling Agni is chief ornament, and, all-desired, loves his laud well,

Sanskit Text: हव्या वा वेविषद विषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: havyā vā veviṣad viṣaḥ ||
Translation: And zealously tends his offerings-

Sanskit Text: विप्रस्य वा सतुवतः सहसो यहो मक्षूतमस्य रातिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viprasya vā stuvataḥ sahaso yaho makṣūtamasya rātiṣu |
Translation: 12 His, or the lauding sage's word, his, Son of Strength! who Is most prompt with sacred gifts,

Sanskit Text: अवोदेवमुपरिमर्त्यं कर्धि वसो विविदुषो वचः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avodevamuparimartyaṃ kṛdhi vaso vividuṣo vacaḥ ||
Translation: Set thou beneath the Gods, Vasu, above mankind, the speech of the intelligent.

Sanskit Text: यो अग्निं हव्यदातिभिर्नमोभिर्वा सुदक्षमाविवासति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo aghniṃ havyadātibhirnamobhirvā sudakṣamāvivāsati |
Translation: 13 He who with sacrificial gifts or homage bringeth very skilful Agni nigh,

Sanskit Text: गिरा वाजिरशोचिषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghirā vājiraśociṣam ||
Translation: Or him who flashes fast with song,

Sanskit Text: समिधा यो निशिती दाशददितिं धामभिरस्य मर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samidhā yo niśitī dāśadaditiṃ dhāmabhirasya martyaḥ |
Translation: 14 The mortal who with blazing fuel, as his laws command, adores the Perfect God,

Sanskit Text: विश्वेत स धीभिः सुभगो जनानति दयुम्नैरुद्न इव तारिषत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvet sa dhībhiḥ subhagho janānati dyumnairudna iva tāriṣat ||
Translation: Blest with his thoughts in splendour shall exceed all men, as though he overpassed the floods.

Sanskit Text: तदग्ने दयुम्नमा भर यत सासहत सदने कं चिदत्रिणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadaghne dyumnamā bhara yat sāsahat sadane kaṃ cidatriṇam |
Translation: 15 Give us the splendour, Agni, which may overcome each greedy fiend in our abode,

Sanskit Text: मन्युं जनस्य दूढ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manyuṃ janasya dūḍhyaḥ ||
Translation: The wrath of evil-hearted folk.

Sanskit Text: येन चष्टे वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा येन नासत्या भगः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena caṣṭe varuṇo mitro aryamā yena nāsatyā bhaghaḥ |
Translation: 16 That, wherewith Mitra, Varuṇa, and Aryaman, the Aśvins, Bhaga give us light,

Sanskit Text: वयं तत ते शवसा गातुवित्तमा इन्द्रत्वोता विधेमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ tat te śavasā ghātuvittamā indratvotā vidhemahi ||
Translation: That may we, by thy power finding best furtherance, worship, O Indra, helped by thee.

Sanskit Text: ते घेदग्ने सवाध्यो ये तवा विप्र निदधिरे नर्चक्षसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te ghedaghne svādhyo ye tvā vipra nidadhire nṛcakṣasam |
Translation: 17 O Agni, most devout are they, the sages who have set thee Sage exceeding wise,

Sanskit Text: विप्रासो देव सुक्रतुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viprāso deva sukratum ||
Translation: O God, for men to look upon:

Sanskit Text: त इद वेदिं सुभग त आहुतिं ते सोतुं चक्रिरे दिवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta id vediṃ subhagha ta āhutiṃ te sotuṃ cakrire divi |
Translation: 18 Who have arranged thine altar Blessed God, at morn brought thine oblation, pressed the juice.

Sanskit Text: तैद वाजेभिर्जिग्युर्महद धनं ये तवे कामं नयेरिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taid vājebhirjighyurmahad dhanaṃ ye tve kāmaṃ nyerire ||
Translation: They by their deeds of strength have won diem, mighty wealth, who have set all their hope in thee.

Sanskit Text: भद्रो नो अग्निराहुतो भद्रा रातिः सुभग भद्रो अध्वरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadro no aghnirāhuto bhadrā rātiḥ subhagha bhadro adhvaraḥ |
Translation: 19 -May Agni worshipped bring us bliss, may the gift, Blessed One, and sacrifice bring bliss;

Sanskit Text: भद्रा उत परशस्तयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadrā uta praśastayaḥ ||
Translation: Yea, may our praises bring us bliss.

Sanskit Text: भद्रं मनः कर्णुष्व वर्त्रतूर्ये येना समत्सु सासहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadraṃ manaḥ kṛṇuṣva vṛtratūrye yenā samatsu sāsahaḥ |
Translation: 20 Show forth the mind that brings success in war with fiends, wherewith thou conquerest in fight.

Sanskit Text: अव सथिरा तनुहि भूरि शर्धतां वनेमा ते अभिष्टिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava sthirā tanuhi bhūri śardhatāṃ vanemā te abhiṣṭibhiḥ ||
Translation: Bring down the many firm hopes of our enemies, and let us vanquish with thine aid.

Sanskit Text: ईळे गिरा मनुर्हितं यं देवा दूतमरतिं नयेरिरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īḷe ghirā manurhitaṃ yaṃ devā dūtamaratiṃ nyerire |
Translation: 21 I praise with song the Friend of man, whom Gods sent down to be herald and messenger,

Sanskit Text: यजिष्ठं हव्यवाहनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajiṣṭhaṃ havyavāhanam ||
Translation: Best worshipper, bearer of our gifts.

Sanskit Text: तिग्मजम्भाय तरुणाय राजते परयो गायस्यग्नये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tighmajambhāya taruṇāya rājate prayo ghāyasyaghnaye |
Translation: 22 Thou unto sharp-toothed Agni, Young and Radiant God, proclaimest with thy song the feast-

Sanskit Text: यः पिंशते सून्र्ताभिः सुवीर्यमग्निर्घ्र्तेभिराहुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ piṃśate sūnṛtābhiḥ suvīryamaghnirghṛtebhirāhutaḥ ||
Translation: Agni, who for our sweet strains moulds heroic strength when sacred oil is offered him,

Sanskit Text: यदी घर्तेभिराहुतो वाशीमग्निर्भरत उच्चाव च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadī ghṛtebhirāhuto vāśīmaghnirbharata uccāva ca |
Translation: 23 While, served with sacrificial oil, now upward and now downward Agni moves his sword,

Sanskit Text: असुर इव निर्णिजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asura iva nirṇijam ||
Translation: As doth the Asura his robe.

Sanskit Text: यो हव्यान्यैरयता मनुर्हितो देव आसा सुगन्धिना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo havyānyairayatā manurhito deva āsā sughandhinā |
Translation: 24 The God, the Friend of man, who bears our gifts to heaven, the God with his sweet-smelling mouth,

Sanskit Text: विवासते वार्याणि सवध्वरो होता देवो अमर्त्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vivāsate vāryāṇi svadhvaro hotā devo amartyaḥ ||
Translation: Distributes, skilled in sacrifice, his precious things, Invoking Priest, Immortal God.

Sanskit Text: यदग्ने मर्त्यस्त्वं सयामहं मित्रमहो अमर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadaghne martyastvaṃ syāmahaṃ mitramaho amartyaḥ |
Translation: 25 Son of Strength, Agni, if thou wert the mortal, bright as Mitra, I worshipped with our gifts!

Sanskit Text: सहसः सूनवाहुत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasaḥ sūnavāhuta ||
Translation: And I were the Immortal God

Sanskit Text: न तवा रासीयाभिशस्तये वसो न पापत्वाय सन्त्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na tvā rāsīyābhiśastaye vaso na pāpatvāya santya |
Translation: 26 I would not give thee up, Vasu, to calumny, or misery, O Bounteous One.

Sanskit Text: न मे सतोतामतीवा न दुर्हितः सयादग्ने न पापया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na me stotāmatīvā na durhitaḥ syādaghne na pāpayā ||
Translation: My worshipper should feel no hunger or distress, nor, Agni, should he live in sin.

Sanskit Text: पितुर्न पुत्रः सुभ्र्तो दुरोण आ देवानेतु पर णो हविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: piturna putraḥ subhṛto duroṇa ā devānetu pra ṇo haviḥ ||
Translation: 27 Like a son cherished in his father's houi§e, let our oblation rise unto the Gods.

Sanskit Text: तवाहमग्न ऊतिभिर्नेदिष्ठाभिः सचेय जोषमा वसो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tavāhamaghna ūtibhirnediṣṭhābhiḥ saceya joṣamā vaso |
Translation: 28 With thine immediate aid may I, excellent Agni, ever gain my wish

Sanskit Text: सदा देवस्य मर्त्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadā devasya martyaḥ ||
Translation: A mortal with a God to help.

Sanskit Text: तव करत्वा सनेयं तव रातिभिरग्ने तव परशस्तिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava kratvā saneyaṃ tava rātibhiraghne tava praśastibhiḥ |
Translation: 29 O Agni, by thy wisdom, by thy bounties, by thy leading may I gather wealth.

Sanskit Text: तवामिदाहुः परमतिं वसो ममाग्ने हर्षस्व दातवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmidāhuḥ pramatiṃ vaso mamāghne harṣasva dātave ||
Translation: Excellent Agni, thou art called my Providence: delight thou to be liberal.

Sanskit Text: पर सो अग्ने तवोतिभिः सुवीराभिस्तिरते वाजभर्मभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra so aghne tavotibhiḥ suvīrābhistirate vājabharmabhiḥ |
Translation: 30 Agni, he conquers by thine aid that brings him store of noble heroes and great strength,

Sanskit Text: यस्य तवं सख्यमावरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya tvaṃ sakhyamāvaraḥ ||
Translation: Whose bond of friendship is thy choice.

Sanskit Text: तव दरप्सो नीलवान वाश रत्विय इन्धानः सिष्णवा ददे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava drapso nīlavān vāśa ṛtviya indhānaḥ siṣṇavā dade |
Translation: 31 Thy spark is black and crackling, kindled in due time, O Bounteous, it is taken up.

Sanskit Text: तवं महीनामुषसामसि परियः कषपो वस्तुषु राजसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ mahīnāmuṣasāmasi priyaḥ kṣapo vastuṣu rājasi ||
Translation: Thou art the dear Friend of the mighty Mornings: thou shinest in glimmerings of the night.

Sanskit Text: तमागन्म सोभरयः सहस्रमुष्कं सवभिष्टिमवसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamāghanma sobharayaḥ sahasramuṣkaṃ svabhiṣṭimavase |
Translation: 32 We Sobharis have come to him, for succour, who is good to help with thousand powers,

Sanskit Text: सम्राजं तरासदस्यवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samrājaṃ trāsadasyavam ||
Translation: The Sovran, Trasadasyu's Friend.

Sanskit Text: यस्य ते अग्ने अन्ये अग्नय उपक्षितो वया इव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya te aghne anye aghnaya upakṣito vayā iva |
Translation: 33 O Agni, thou on whom all other fires depend, as branches on the parent stem,

Sanskit Text: विपो न दयुम्ना नि युवे जनानां तव कषत्राणि वर्धयन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vipo na dyumnā ni yuve janānāṃ tava kṣatrāṇi vardhayan ||
Translation: I make the treasures of the folk, like songs, mine own, while I exalt thy sovran might.

Sanskit Text: यमादित्यासो अद्रुहः पारं नयथ मर्त्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamādityāso adruhaḥ pāraṃ nayatha martyam |
Translation: 34 The mortal whom, Ādityas, ye, Guilelew, lead to the farther bank

Sanskit Text: मघोनां विश्वेषां सुदानवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maghonāṃ viśveṣāṃ sudānavaḥ ||
Translation: Of all the princes, Bounteous Ones

Sanskit Text: यूयं राजानः कं चिच्चर्षणीसहः कषयन्तं मानुषाननु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyaṃ rājānaḥ kaṃ ciccarṣaṇīsahaḥ kṣayantaṃ mānuṣānanu |
Translation: 35 Whoe’er he be, Man-ruling Kings! the Regent of the race of men-

Sanskit Text: वयं ते वो वरुण मित्रार्यमन सयामेद रतस्य रथ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ te vo varuṇa mitrāryaman syāmed ṛtasya rathyaḥ ||
Translation: May we, O Mitra, Varuṇa, and Aryaman, like him be furtherers of your law.

Sanskit Text: अदान मे पौरुकुत्स्यः पञ्चाशतं तरसदस्युर्वधूनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adān me paurukutsyaḥ pañcāśataṃ trasadasyurvadhūnām |
Translation: 36 A gift of fifty female slaves hath Trasadasyu given me, Purukutsa's son,

Sanskit Text: मंहिष्ठो अर्यः सत्पतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maṃhiṣṭho aryaḥ satpatiḥ ||
Translation: Most liberal, kind, lord of the brave.

Sanskit Text: उत मे परयियोर्वयियोः सुवास्त्वा अधि तुग्वनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta me prayiyorvayiyoḥ suvāstvā adhi tughvani |
Translation: 37 And Śyāva too for me led forth a strong steed at Suvastu's ford:

Sanskit Text: तिसॄणांसप्ततीनां शयावः परणेता भुवद वसुर्दियानां पतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisṝṇāṃsaptatīnāṃ śyāvaḥ praṇetā bhuvad vasurdiyānāṃ patiḥ ||
Translation: A herd of three times seventy kine, good lord of gifts, he gave to me.

Sanskit Text: आ गन्ता मा रिषण्यत परस्थावानो माप सथाता समन्यवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ghantā mā riṣaṇyata prasthāvāno māpa sthātā samanyavaḥ |
Translation: 1. LET none, Swift Travellers! check you: come hither, like-spirited, stay not far away,

Sanskit Text: सथिरा चिन नमयिष्णवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sthirā cin namayiṣṇavaḥ ||
Translation: Ye benders even of what is firm.

Sanskit Text: वीळुपविभिर्मरुत रभुक्षण आ रुद्रासः सुदीतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vīḷupavibhirmaruta ṛbhukṣaṇa ā rudrāsaḥ sudītibhiḥ |
Translation: 2 Maruts, Ṛbhukṣans, Rudras come ye with your cars strong-fellied and exceeding bright.

Sanskit Text: इषा नो अद्या गता पुरुस्प्र्हो यज्ञमा सोभरीयवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣā no adyā ghatā puruspṛho yajñamā sobharīyavaḥ ||
Translation: Come, ye for whom we long, with food, to sacrifice, come ye with love to Sobbari.

Sanskit Text: विद्मा हि रुद्रियाणां शुष्ममुग्रं मरुतां शिमीवताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidmā hi rudriyāṇāṃ śuṣmamughraṃ marutāṃ śimīvatām |
Translation: 3 For well we know the vigorous might of Rudra's Sons, the Martits, who are passing strong,

Sanskit Text: विष्णोरेषस्य मीळ्हुषाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viṣṇoreṣasya mīḷhuṣām ||
Translation: Swift Viṣṇu's band, who send the rain.,

Sanskit Text: वि दवीपानि पापतन तिष्ठद दुछुनोभे युजन्त रोदसी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi dvīpāni pāpatan tiṣṭhad duchunobhe yujanta rodasī |
Translation: 4 Islands are bursting forth and misery is stayed: the heaven and earth are joined in one.

Sanskit Text: पर धन्वान्यैरत शुभ्रखादयो यदेजथ सवभानवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra dhanvānyairata śubhrakhādayo yadejatha svabhānavaḥ ||
Translation: Decked with bright rings, ye spread the broad expanses out, when ye, Self. luminous, stirred yourselves.

Sanskit Text: अच्युता चिद वो अज्मन्ना नानदति पर्वतासो वनस्पतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: acyutā cid vo ajmannā nānadati parvatāso vanaspatiḥ |
Translation: 5 Even things immovable shake and reel, the mountains and the forest trees at your approach,

Sanskit Text: भूमिर्यामेषु रेजते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūmiryāmeṣu rejate ||
Translation: And the earth trembles as ye come.

Sanskit Text: अमाय वो मरुतो यातवे दयौर्जिहीत उत्तरा बर्हत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: amāya vo maruto yātave dyaurjihīta uttarā bṛhat |
Translation: 6 To lend free course, O Maruts, to your furious rush, heaven high and higher still gives way,

Sanskit Text: यत्रा नरो देदिशते तनूष्वा तवक्षांसि बाह्वोजसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatrā naro dediśate tanūṣvā tvakṣāṃsi bāhvojasaḥ ||
Translation: Where they, the Heroes mighty with their arms, display their gleaming omaments on their forms.

Sanskit Text: सवधामनु शरियं नरो महि तवेषा अमवन्तो वर्षप्सवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svadhāmanu śriyaṃ naro mahi tveṣā amavanto vṛṣapsavaḥ |
Translation: 7 After their Godlike nature they, the bull. like Heroes, dazzling and impetuous, wear

Sanskit Text: वहन्ते अह्रुतप्सवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vahante ahrutapsavaḥ ||
Translation: Great splendour as they show erect.

Sanskit Text: गोभिर्वाणो अज्यते सोभरीणां रथे कोशे हिरण्यये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghobhirvāṇo ajyate sobharīṇāṃ rathe kośe hiraṇyaye |
Translation: 8 The pivot of the Sobharis' chariot within the golden box is balmed with milk.

Sanskit Text: गोबन्धवः सुजातास इषे भुजे महान्तो नः सपरसे नु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghobandhavaḥ sujātāsa iṣe bhuje mahānto naḥ sparase nu ||
Translation: May they the Well-born, Mighty, kindred of the Cow, aid us to food and to delight.

Sanskit Text: परति वो वर्षदञ्जयो वर्ष्णे शर्धाय मारुताय भरध्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati vo vṛṣadañjayo vṛṣṇe śardhāya mārutāya bharadhvam |
Translation: 9 Bring, ye who sprinkle balmy drops. oblations to your vigorous Marut company,

Sanskit Text: हव्या वर्षप्रयाव्णे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: havyā vṛṣaprayāvṇe ||
Translation: To those whose leader is the Bull.

Sanskit Text: वर्षणश्वेन मरुतो वर्षप्सुना रथेन वर्षनाभिना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣaṇaśvena maruto vṛṣapsunā rathena vṛṣanābhinā |
Translation: 10 Come hither, O ye Mares, on your stronghorsed car, solid in look, with solid naves.

Sanskit Text: आ शयेनासो न पक्षिणो वर्था नरो हव्या नो वीतये गत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā śyenāso na pakṣiṇo vṛthā naro havyā no vītaye ghata ||
Translation: Lightly like winged falcons, O ye Heroes, come, come to enjoy our ofrerings.

Sanskit Text: समानमञ्ज्येषां वि भराजन्ते रुक्मासो अधि बाहुषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samānamañjyeṣāṃ vi bhrājante rukmāso adhi bāhuṣu |
Translation: 11 Their decoration is the same: their omaments of gold are bright upon their arms;

Sanskit Text: दविद्युतत्य रष्टयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: davidyutaty ṛṣṭayaḥ ||
Translation: Their lances glitter splendidly.

Sanskit Text: त उग्रासो वर्षण उग्रबाहवो नकिष टनूषु येतिरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta ughrāso vṛṣaṇa ughrabāhavo nakiṣ ṭanūṣu yetire |
Translation: 12 They toil not to defend their bodies from attack, strong Heroes with their mighty arms.

Sanskit Text: सथिरा धन्वान्यायुधा रथेषु वो.अनीकेष्वधि शरियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sthirā dhanvānyāyudhā ratheṣu vo.anīkeṣvadhi śriyaḥ ||
Translation: Strong are your bows and strong the weapons in your cars, and glory sits on every face.

Sanskit Text: येषामर्णो न सप्रथो नाम तवेषं शश्वतामेकमिद्भुजे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yeṣāmarṇo na sapratho nāma tveṣaṃ śaśvatāmekamidbhuje |
Translation: 13 Whose name extendeth like a sea, alone, resplendent, so that all have joy in it,

Sanskit Text: वयो न पित्र्यं सहः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayo na pitryaṃ sahaḥ ||
Translation: And life-power like ancestral might.

Sanskit Text: तान वन्दस्व मरुतस्तानुप सतुहि तेषां हि धुनीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tān vandasva marutastānupa stuhi teṣāṃ hi dhunīnām |
Translation: 14 Pay honour to these Maruts and sing praise to them, for of the wheel-spokes of the car

Sanskit Text: अराणां न चरमस्तदेषां दाना मह्ना तदेषाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arāṇāṃ na caramastadeṣāṃ dānā mahnā tadeṣām ||
Translation: Of these loud roarers none is last: this is their power, this moves them to give mighty gifts.

Sanskit Text: सुभगः स व ऊतिष्वास पूर्वासु मरुतो वयुष्टिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: subhaghaḥ sa va ūtiṣvāsa pūrvāsu maruto vyuṣṭiṣu |
Translation: 15 Blest by your favouring help was he, O Maruts, at the earlier flushings of the morn,

Sanskit Text: योवा नूनमुतासति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yovā nūnamutāsati ||
Translation: And even now shall he be blest.

Sanskit Text: यस्य वा यूयं परति वाजिनो नर आ हव्या वीतये गथ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya vā yūyaṃ prati vājino nara ā havyā vītaye ghatha |
Translation: 16 The strong man to whose sacrifice, O Heroes, ye approach that ye may taste thereof,

Sanskit Text: अभि ष दयुम्नैरुत वाजसातिभिः सुम्ना वो धूतयो नशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi ṣa dyumnairuta vājasātibhiḥ sumnā vo dhūtayo naśat ||
Translation: With glories and with war that winneth spoil shall gain great bliss, ye Shakers of the world.

Sanskit Text: यथा रुद्रस्य सूनवो दिवो वशन्त्यसुरस्य वेधसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā rudrasya sūnavo divo vaśantyasurasya vedhasaḥ |
Translation: 17 Even as Rudra's Sons, the brood of the Creator Dyaus, the Asura, desire,

Sanskit Text: युवानस्तथेदसत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvānastathedasat ||
Translation: O Youthful Ones, so shall it be:

Sanskit Text: ये चार्हन्ति मरुतः सुदानवः समन मीळ्हुषश्चरन्ति ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye cārhanti marutaḥ sudānavaḥ sman mīḷhuṣaścaranti ye |
Translation: 18 And these the bounteous, worthy of the Maruts who move onward pouring down the rain-

Sanskit Text: अतश्चिदा न उप वस्यसा हर्दा युवान आ वव्र्ध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ataścidā na upa vasyasā hṛdā yuvāna ā vavṛdhvam ||
Translation: Even for their sake, O Youthful Ones, with kindest heart take us to you to be your own.

Sanskit Text: यून ऊ षु नविष्ठया वर्ष्णः पावकानभि सोभरे गिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūna ū ṣu naviṣṭhayā vṛṣṇaḥ pāvakānabhi sobhare ghirā |
Translation: 19 O Sobhari, with newest song sing out unto the youthful purifying Bulls,

Sanskit Text: गाय गा इव चर्क्र्षत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāya ghā iva carkṛṣat ||
Translation: Even as a plougher to his steers.

Sanskit Text: साहा ये सन्ति मुष्टिहेव हव्यो विश्वासु पर्त्सु होत्र्षु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sāhā ye santi muṣṭiheva havyo viśvāsu pṛtsu hotṛṣu |
Translation: 20 Who, like a celebrated boxer, overcome the challengers in every fight:

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्णश्चन्द्रान न सुश्रवस्तमान गिरा वन्दस्व मरुतो अह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṇaścandrān na suśravastamān ghirā vandasva maruto aha ||
Translation: They who, like shining bulls, are most illustrious-honour those Maruts with thy song.

Sanskit Text: गावश्चिद घा समन्यवः सजात्येन मरुतः सबन्धवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāvaścid ghā samanyavaḥ sajātyena marutaḥ sabandhavaḥ |
Translation: 21 Allied by common ancestry, ye Maruts, even the Cows, alike in energy,

Sanskit Text: रिहते ककुभो मिथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rihate kakubho mithaḥ ||
Translation: Lick, all by turns, each other's head.

Sanskit Text: मर्तश्चिद वो नर्तवो रुक्मवक्षस उप भरात्र्त्वमायति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: martaścid vo nṛtavo rukmavakṣasa upa bhrātṛtvamāyati |
Translation: 22 Even mortal man, ye Dancers breast adorned with gold, attains to brotherhood with you.

Sanskit Text: अधिनो गात मरुतः सदा हि व आपित्वमस्ति निध्रुवि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhino ghāta marutaḥ sadā hi va āpitvamasti nidhruvi ||
Translation: Mark ye and notice us, O Maruts; evermore your friendship is secured to us.

Sanskit Text: मरुतो मारुतस्य न आ भेषजस्य वहता सुदानवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: maruto mārutasya na ā bheṣajasya vahatā sudānavaḥ |
Translation: 23 O Maruts, rich in noble gifts, bring us a portion of the Maruts’ medicine,

Sanskit Text: यूयंसखायः सप्तयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyaṃsakhāyaḥ saptayaḥ ||
Translation: Ye Coursers who are Friends to us.

Sanskit Text: याभिः सिन्धुमवथ याभिस्तूर्वथ याभिर्दशस्यथाक्रिविम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ sindhumavatha yābhistūrvatha yābhirdaśasyathākrivim |
Translation: 24 Haters of those who serve you not, bliss-bringers, bring us bliss with those auspicious aids

Sanskit Text: मयो नो भूतोतिभिर्मयोभुवः शिवाभिरसचद्विषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mayo no bhūtotibhirmayobhuvaḥ śivābhirasacadviṣaḥ ||
Translation: Wherewith ye are victorious and guard Sindhu well, and succour Krvi in his need.

Sanskit Text: यत सिन्धौ यदसिक्न्यां यत समुद्रेषु मरुतः सुबर्हिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat sindhau yadasiknyāṃ yat samudreṣu marutaḥ subarhiṣaḥ |
Translation: 25 Maruts, who rest on fair trimmed grass, what balm soever Sindhu or Asikni hath,

Sanskit Text: यत पर्वतेषु भेषजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat parvateṣu bheṣajam ||
Translation: Or mountains or the seas contain.

Sanskit Text: विश्वं पश्यन्तो बिभ्र्था तनूष्वा तेना नो अधि वोचत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvaṃ paśyanto bibhṛthā tanūṣvā tenā no adhi vocata |
Translation: 26 Ye carry on your bodies, ye who see it all: so bless us graciously therewith.

Sanskit Text: कषमा रपो मरुत आतुरस्य न इष्कर्ता विह्रुतं पुनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣamā rapo maruta āturasya na iṣkartā vihrutaṃ punaḥ ||
Translation: Cast, Maruts, to the ground our sick man's malady: replace the dislocated limb.

Sanskit Text: वयमु तवामपूर्व्य सथूरं न कच्चिद भरन्तो.अवस्यवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayamu tvāmapūrvya sthūraṃ na kaccid bharanto.avasyavaḥ |
Translation: 1. WE call on thee, O Matchless One! We seeking help, possessing nothing firm ourselves,

Sanskit Text: वाजे चित्रं हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāje citraṃ havāmahe ||
Translation: Call on thee wonderful in fight
