Sanskit Text: उप तवा कर्मन्नूतये स नो युवोग्रश्चक्राम यो धर्षत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa tvā karmannūtaye sa no yuvoghraścakrāma yo dhṛṣat |
Translation: 2 On thee for aid in sacrifice. This youth of ours, the bold, the mighty, hath gonse forth.

Sanskit Text: तवामिद धयवितारं वव्र्महे सखाय इन्द्र सानसिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmid dhyavitāraṃ vavṛmahe sakhāya indra sānasim ||
Translation: We therefore, we thy friends, Indra, havie chosen thee, free-giver, as our Guardian God.

Sanskit Text: आ याहीम इन्दवो.अश्वपते गोपत उर्वरापते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yāhīma indavo.aśvapate ghopata urvarāpate |
Translation: 3 Come hither, for the drops are here, O Lord of corn-lands. Lord of horses, Lord of kine:

Sanskit Text: सोमं सोमपते पिब ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaṃ somapate piba ||
Translation: Drink thou the Soma, Soma's Lord!

Sanskit Text: वयं हि तवा बन्धुमन्तमबन्धवो विप्रास इन्द्र येमिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ hi tvā bandhumantamabandhavo viprāsa indra yemima |
Translation: 4 For we the kinless singers have drawn hither thee, O Indra, who hast numerous kin.

Sanskit Text: या ते धामानि वर्षभ तेभिरा गहि विश्वेभिः सोमपीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā te dhāmāni vṛṣabha tebhirā ghahi viśvebhiḥ somapītaye ||
Translation: With all the forms thou hast, comic thou of bull-like strength, come near to drink the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: सीदन्तस्ते वयो यथा गोश्रीते मधौ मदिरे विवक्षणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sīdantaste vayo yathā ghośrīte madhau madire vivakṣaṇe |
Translation: 5 Sitting like birds beside thy meath., mingled with milk, that gladdeneth and exalteth thee,

Sanskit Text: अभि तवामिन्द्र नोनुमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tvāmindra nonumaḥ ||
Translation: Indra, to thee we sing aloud.

Sanskit Text: अछा च तवैना नमसा वदामसि किं मुहुश्चिद वि दीधयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā ca tvainā namasā vadāmasi kiṃ muhuścid vi dīdhayaḥ |
Translation: 6 We speak to thee with this our reverential prayer. Why art thou pondering yet awhile?

Sanskit Text: सन्ति कामासो हरिवो ददिष टवं समो वयं सन्ति नो धियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: santi kāmāso harivo dadiṣ ṭvaṃ smo vayaṃ santi no dhiyaḥ ||
Translation: Here are our wishes; thou art liberal, Lord of Bays: we and our hymns are present here.

Sanskit Text: नूत्ना इदिन्द्र ते वयमूती अभूम नहि नू ते अद्रिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nūtnā idindra te vayamūtī abhūma nahi nū te adrivaḥ |
Translation: 7 For not in recent times alone, O Indra, Thunder-armed, have we obtained thine aid.

Sanskit Text: विद्मा पुरा परीणसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidmā purā parīṇasaḥ ||
Translation: Of old we knew thy plenteous wealth.

Sanskit Text: विद्मा सखित्वमुत शूर भोज्यमा ते ता वज्रिन्नीमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidmā sakhitvamuta śūra bhojyamā te tā vajrinnīmahe |
Translation: 8 Hero, we knew thy friendship and thy rich rewards: these, Thunderer, now we crave of thee.

Sanskit Text: उतो समस्मिन्ना शिशीहि नो वसो वाजे सुशिप्र गोमति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto samasminnā śiśīhi no vaso vāje suśipra ghomati ||
Translation: O Vasu, for all wealth that cometh of the kine, sharpen our powers, fair-visored God.

Sanskit Text: यो न इदम-इदं पुरा पर वस्य आनिनाय तमु व सतुषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo na idam-idaṃ purā pra vasya ānināya tamu va stuṣe |
Translation: 9 Him who of old hath brought to us this and that blessing, him I magnify for you,

Sanskit Text: सखाय इन्द्रमूतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhāya indramūtaye ||
Translation: Even Indra, O my friends, for help

Sanskit Text: हर्यश्वं सत्पतिं चर्षणीसहं स हि षमा यो अमन्दत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: haryaśvaṃ satpatiṃ carṣaṇīsahaṃ sa hi ṣmā yo amandata |
Translation: 10 Borne by Bay Steeds, the Lord of heroes, ruling men, for it is he who takes; delight.

Sanskit Text: आ तु नः स वयति गव्यमश्व्यं सतोत्र्भ्यो मघवा शतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tu naḥ sa vayati ghavyamaśvyaṃ stotṛbhyo maghavā śatam ||
Translation: May Maghavan bestow on us his worshippers hundreds of cattle and of steeds.

Sanskit Text: तवया ह सविद युजा वयं परति शवसन्तं वर्षभ बरुवीमहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā ha svid yujā vayaṃ prati śvasantaṃ vṛṣabha bruvīmahi |
Translation: 11 Hero, may we, with thee for Friend, withstand the man who pants against us in his wrath,

Sanskit Text: संस्थे जनस्य गोमतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃsthe janasya ghomataḥ ||
Translation: In fight with people rich in kine.

Sanskit Text: जयेम कारे पुरुहूत कारिणो.अभि तिष्ठेम दूढ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jayema kāre puruhūta kāriṇo.abhi tiṣṭhema dūḍhyaḥ |
Translation: 12 May we be victors in the singer's battlesong, and meet the wicked, Much invoked!

Sanskit Text: नर्भिर्व्र्त्रं हन्याम शूशुयाम चावेरिन्द्र पर णो धियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛbhirvṛtraṃ hanyāma śūśuyāma cāverindra pra ṇo dhiyaḥ ||
Translation: With heroes smite the foeman and show forth our strength. O Indra, further thou our thoughts.

Sanskit Text: अभ्रात्र्व्यो अना तवमनापिरिन्द्र जनुषा सनादसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhrātṛvyo anā tvamanāpirindra januṣā sanādasi |
Translation: 13 O Indra, from all ancient time rivalless ever and companionless art thou:

Sanskit Text: युधेदापित्वमिछसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yudhedāpitvamichase ||
Translation: Thou seekest comradeship in war.

Sanskit Text: नकी रेवन्तं सख्याय विन्दसे पीयन्ति ते सुराश्वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nakī revantaṃ sakhyāya vindase pīyanti te surāśvaḥ |
Translation: 14 Thou findest not the wealthy man to be thy friend: those scorn thee who are flown with wine.

Sanskit Text: यदा कर्णोषि नदनुं समूहस्यादित पितेव हूयसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā kṛṇoṣi nadanuṃ samūhasyādit piteva hūyase ||
Translation: What time thou thunderest and gatherest, then thou, even as a Father, art invoked.

Sanskit Text: मा ते अमाजुरो यथा मूरास इन्द्र सख्ये तवावतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā te amājuro yathā mūrāsa indra sakhye tvāvataḥ |
Translation: 15 O Indra, let us not, like fools who waste their lives at home, with friendship such as thine

Sanskit Text: नि षदाम सचा सुते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni ṣadāma sacā sute ||
Translation: Sit idly by the poured-out juice.

Sanskit Text: मा ते गोदत्र निरराम राधस इन्द्र मा ते गर्हामहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā te ghodatra nirarāma rādhasa indra mā te ghṛhāmahi |
Translation: 16 Giver of kine, may we not miss thy gracious gifts: let us not rob thee of thine own.

Sanskit Text: दर्ळ्हा चिदर्यः पर मर्शाभ्या भर न ते दामान आदभे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dṛḷhā cidaryaḥ pra mṛśābhyā bhara na te dāmāna ādabhe ||
Translation: Strip even the strong places of the foe, and bring: thy gifts can never be made vain.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो वा घेदियन मघं सरस्वती वा सुभगा ददिर्वसु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro vā ghediyan maghaṃ sarasvatī vā subhaghā dadirvasu |
Translation: 17 Indra or blest Sarasvatī alone bestows such wealth, treasure so great, or thou,

Sanskit Text: तवं वा चित्र दाशुषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ vā citra dāśuṣe ||
Translation: O Citra, on the worshipper.

Sanskit Text: चित्र इद राजा राजका इदन्यके यके सरस्वतीमनु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: citra id rājā rājakā idanyake yake sarasvatīmanu |
Translation: 18 Citra is King, and only kinglings are the rest who dwell beside Sarasvatī.

Sanskit Text: पर्जन्य इव ततनद धि वर्ष्ट्या सहस्रमयुता ददत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parjanya iva tatanad dhi vṛṣṭyā sahasramayutā dadat ||
Translation: He, like Parjanya with his rain, hath spread himself with thousand, yea, with myriad gifts.

Sanskit Text: ओ तयमह्व आ रथमद्या दंसिष्ठमूतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: o tyamahva ā rathamadyā daṃsiṣṭhamūtaye |
Translation: 1. HITHERWARD have I called to-day, for succour, that most wondrous car

Sanskit Text: यमश्विना सुहवा रुद्रवर्तनी आ सूर्यायै तस्थथुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamaśvinā suhavā rudravartanī ā sūryāyai tasthathuḥ ||
Translation: Which ye ascended, Aśvins, ye whose paths are red, swift to give Car, for Sūrya's sake.

Sanskit Text: पूर्वायुषं सुहवं पुरुस्प्र्हं भुज्युं वाजेषु पूर्व्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvāyuṣaṃ suhavaṃ puruspṛhaṃ bhujyuṃ vājeṣu pūrvyam |
Translation: 2 Car ever young, much longed-for, easily invoked, soon guided, first in deeds of might,

Sanskit Text: सचनावन्तं सुमतिभिः सोभरे विद्वेषसमनेहसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sacanāvantaṃ sumatibhiḥ sobhare vidveṣasamanehasam ||
Translation: Which waits and serves, O Sobhari, with benevolence, without a rival or a foe.

Sanskit Text: इह तया पुरुभूतमा देवा नमोभिरश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iha tyā purubhūtamā devā namobhiraśvinā |
Translation: 3 These Aśvins with our homage, these Two Omnipresent Deities

Sanskit Text: अर्वाचीना सववसे करामहे गन्तारा दशुषो गर्हम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvācīnā svavase karāmahe ghantārā daśuṣo ghṛham ||
Translation: Hitherward will we bring for kind help, these who seek the dwelling of the worshipper.

Sanskit Text: युवो रथस्य परि चक्रमीयत ईर्मान्यद वामिषण्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvo rathasya pari cakramīyata īrmānyad vāmiṣaṇyati |
Translation: 4 One of your chariot wheels is moving swiftly round, one speeds for you its onward course.

Sanskit Text: अस्मानछा सुमतिर्वां शुभस पती आ धेनुरिव धावतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmānachā sumatirvāṃ śubhas patī ā dhenuriva dhāvatu ||
Translation: Like a milch-cow, O Lords of splendour, and with haste let your benevolence come to us.

Sanskit Text: रथो यो वां तरिवन्धुरो हिरण्यभीशुरश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ratho yo vāṃ trivandhuro hiraṇyabhīśuraśvinā |
Translation: 5 That chariot of yours which hath a triple seat and reins of gold,

Sanskit Text: परि दयावाप्र्थिवी भूषति शरुतस्तेन नासत्या गतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari dyāvāpṛthivī bhūṣati śrutastena nāsatyā ghatam ||
Translation: The famous car that traverseth the heaven and earth, thereon Nāsatyas, Aśvins, come.

Sanskit Text: दशस्यन्ता मनवे पूर्व्यं दिवि यवं वर्केण कर्षथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśasyantā manave pūrvyaṃ divi yavaṃ vṛkeṇa karṣathaḥ |
Translation: 6 Ye with your plough, when favouring Manu with your help, ploughed the first harvest in the sky.

Sanskit Text: ता वामद्य सुमतिभिः शुभस पती अश्विना पर सतुवीमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā vāmadya sumatibhiḥ śubhas patī aśvinā pra stuvīmahi ||
Translation: As such will we exalt you, Lords of splendour, now, O Aśvins, with our prayer and praise.

Sanskit Text: उप नो वजिनीवसू यातं रतस्य पथिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa no vajinīvasū yātaṃ ṛtasya pathibhiḥ |
Translation: 7 Come to us, Lords of ample wealth, by paths of everlasting Law,

Sanskit Text: येभिस्त्र्क्षिं वर्षणा तरसदस्यवं महे कषत्राय जिन्वथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yebhistṛkṣiṃ vṛṣaṇā trasadasyavaṃ mahe kṣatrāya jinvathaḥ ||
Translation: Whereby to high dominion ye with mighty strength raised Trksi, Trasadasyu's son.

Sanskit Text: अयं वामद्रिभिः सुतः सोमो नर वर्षण्वसु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ vāmadribhiḥ sutaḥ somo nara vṛṣaṇvasu |
Translation: 8 This Soma pressed with stones is yours, ye Heroes, Lords of plenteous wealth.

Sanskit Text: आ यातं सोमपीतये पिबतं दाशुषो गर्हे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yātaṃ somapītaye pibataṃ dāśuṣo ghṛhe ||
Translation: Approach to drink the Soma, come, drink in the worshipper's abode.

Sanskit Text: आ हि रुहतमश्विना रथे कोशे हिरण्यये वर्षण्वसू |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā hi ruhatamaśvinā rathe kośe hiraṇyaye vṛṣaṇvasū |
Translation: 9 O Aśvins, mount the chariot, mount the golden seat, ye who are Lords of plenteous wealth,

Sanskit Text: युञ्जाथां पीवरीरिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuñjāthāṃ pīvarīriṣaḥ ||
Translation: And bring to us abundant food.

Sanskit Text: याभिः पक्थमवथो याभिरध्रिगुं याभिर्बभ्रुं विजोषसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ pakthamavatho yābhiradhrighuṃ yābhirbabhruṃ vijoṣasam |
Translation: 10 The aids wherewith ye helped Paktha and Adhrigt;, and Babhru severed from his friends,—

Sanskit Text: ताभिर्नो मक्षू तूयमश्विना गतं भिषज्यतंयदातुरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tābhirno makṣū tūyamaśvinā ghataṃ bhiṣajyataṃyadāturam ||
Translation: With those, O Aśvins, come hither with speed and soon, and heal whatever is diseased.

Sanskit Text: यदध्रिगावो अध्रिगू इदा चिदह्नो अश्विना हवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadadhrighāvo adhrighū idā cidahno aśvinā havāmahe |
Translation: 11 When we continually invoke the Aśvins, the resistless, at this time of day,

Sanskit Text: वयं गीर्भिर्विपन्यवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ ghīrbhirvipanyavaḥ ||
Translation: We lovers of the song, with songs.

Sanskit Text: ताभिरा यातं वर्षणोप मे हवं विश्वप्सुं विश्ववार्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tābhirā yātaṃ vṛṣaṇopa me havaṃ viśvapsuṃ viśvavāryam |
Translation: 12 Through these, ye Mighty Ones, come hither to my call which brings all blessings, wears all forms,—

Sanskit Text: इषा मंहिष्ठा पुरुभूतमा नरा याभिः करिविं वव्र्धुस्ताभिरा गतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣā maṃhiṣṭhā purubhūtamā narā yābhiḥ kriviṃ vavṛdhustābhirā ghatam ||
Translation: Tlirough which, All-present Heroes, lavishest of food ye strengthened Krvi, come through these.

Sanskit Text: ताविदा चिदहानां तावश्विना वन्दमान उप बरुवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāvidā cidahānāṃ tāvaśvinā vandamāna upa bruve |
Translation: 13 I speak to both of these as such, these Aśvins whom I reverence at this time of day:

Sanskit Text: ता उ नमोभिरीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā u namobhirīmahe ||
Translation: With homage we entreat them both.

Sanskit Text: ताविद दोषा ता उषसि शुभस पती ता यामन रुद्रवर्तनी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāvid doṣā tā uṣasi śubhas patī tā yāman rudravartanī |
Translation: 14 Ye who are Lords of splendour, ye whose paths are red, at eve, at mom, at sacrifice,

Sanskit Text: मा नो मर्ताय रिपवे वाजिनीवसू परो रुद्रावति खयतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no martāya ripave vājinīvasū paro rudrāvati khyatam ||
Translation: Give us not utterly as prey to mortal foe, ye Rudras, Lords of ample wealth.

Sanskit Text: आ सुग्म्याय सुग्म्यं पराता रथेनाश्विना वा सक्षणी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā sughmyāya sughmyaṃ prātā rathenāśvinā vā sakṣaṇī |
Translation: 15 For bliss I call. the blissful car, at morn the inseparable Aśvins with their car

Sanskit Text: हुवे पितेव सोभरी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: huve piteva sobharī ||
Translation: I call, like Sobhari our sire.

Sanskit Text: मनोजवसा वर्षणा मदच्युता मक्षुंगमाभिरुतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: manojavasā vṛṣaṇā madacyutā makṣuṃghamābhirutibhiḥ |
Translation: 16 Rapid as thought, and strong, and speeding to thejoy, bringing.your swiftly-coming help,

Sanskit Text: आरात्ताच्चिद भूतमस्मे अवसे पुर्वीभिः पुरुभोजसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ārāttāccid bhūtamasme avase purvībhiḥ purubhojasā ||
Translation: Be to us a protection even from far away Lords of great wealth, with many aids.'

Sanskit Text: आ नो अश्वावदश्विना वर्तिर्यासिष्टं मधुपातमा नरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no aśvāvadaśvinā vartiryāsiṣṭaṃ madhupātamā narā |
Translation: 17 Come, Wonder-Workers, to our home, our home, O Aśvins, rich in cattle, steeds, and gold,

Sanskit Text: गोमद दस्रा हिरण्यवत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghomad dasrā hiraṇyavat ||
Translation: Chief drinkers of the Soma's juice

Sanskit Text: सुप्रावर्गं सुवीर्यं सुष्ठु वार्यमनाध्र्ष्टं रक्षस्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suprāvarghaṃ suvīryaṃ suṣṭhu vāryamanādhṛṣṭaṃ rakṣasvinā |
Translation: 18 Choice-worthy strength, heroic, firm and excellent, uninjured by the Rakṣas foe,

Sanskit Text: अस्मिन्ना वामायाने वाजिनीवसू विश्वा वामानि धीमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asminnā vāmāyāne vājinīvasū viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi ||
Translation: At this your coming nigh, ye Lords of ample wealth and all good things, may we obtain.

Sanskit Text: ईळिष्वा हि परतीव्यं यजस्व जातवेदसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īḷiṣvā hi pratīvyaṃ yajasva jātavedasam |
Translation: 1. WORSHIP thou Jātavedas, pray to him who willingly accepts,

Sanskit Text: चरिष्णुधूममग्र्भीतशोचिषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cariṣṇudhūmamaghṛbhītaśociṣam ||
Translation: Whose smoke wanders at will, and none may grasp his flame.

Sanskit Text: दामानं विश्वचर्षणे.अग्निं विश्वमनो गिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dāmānaṃ viśvacarṣaṇe.aghniṃ viśvamano ghirā |
Translation: 2 Thou, all men's friend, Visvamanas, exaltest Agni with thy song,

Sanskit Text: उत सतुषे विष्पर्धसो रथानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta stuṣe viṣpardhaso rathānām ||
Translation: The Giver, and his flames with which no cars contend.

Sanskit Text: येषामाबाध रग्मिय इषः पर्क्षश्च निग्रभे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yeṣāmābādha ṛghmiya iṣaḥ pṛkṣaśca nighrabhe |
Translation: 3 Whose resolute assault, to win vigour and food, deserves our praise,—

Sanskit Text: उपविदावह्निर्विन्दते वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upavidāvahnirvindate vasu ||
Translation: Through whose discovering power the priest obtaineth wealth.

Sanskit Text: उदस्य शोचिरस्थाद दीदियुषो वयजरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udasya śocirasthād dīdiyuṣo vyajaram |
Translation: 4 Up springs the imperishable flame, the flame of the Refulgent One

Sanskit Text: तपुर्जम्भस्य सुद्युतो गणश्रियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tapurjambhasya sudyuto ghaṇaśriyaḥ ||
Translation: Most bright, with glowing jaws and glory in his train.

Sanskit Text: उदु तिष्ठ सवध्वर सतवानो देव्या कर्पा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udu tiṣṭha svadhvara stavāno devyā kṛpā |
Translation: 5 Skilled in fair sacrifice, extolled, arise in Godlike loveliness,

Sanskit Text: अभिख्या भासा बर्हता शुशुक्वनिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhikhyā bhāsā bṛhatā śuśukvaniḥ ||
Translation: Shining with lofty splendour, with effulgent light.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने याहि सुशस्तिभिर्हव्या जुह्वान आनुषक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne yāhi suśastibhirhavyā juhvāna ānuṣak |
Translation: 6 Called straight to our oblations, come, O Agni, through our eulogies,

Sanskit Text: यथा दूतो बभूथ हव्यवाहनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā dūto babhūtha havyavāhanaḥ ||
Translation: As thou hast been our envoy bearing up our gifts.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं वः पूर्व्यं हुवे होतारं चर्षणीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ vaḥ pūrvyaṃ huve hotāraṃ carṣaṇīnām |
Translation: 7 I call your Agni, from of old Invoking Priest of living men:

Sanskit Text: तमया वाचा गर्णे तमु व सतुषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamayā vācā ghṛṇe tamu va stuṣe ||
Translation: Him with this song I laud and magnify for you.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञेभिरद्भुतक्रतुं यं कर्पा सूदयन्त इत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñebhiradbhutakratuṃ yaṃ kṛpā sūdayanta it |
Translation: 8 Whom, wondrous wise, they animate with solemn rites and his fair form,

Sanskit Text: मित्रं न जने सुधितं रतावनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitraṃ na jane sudhitaṃ ṛtāvani ||
Translation: Kind as a friend to men who keep the holy Law.

Sanskit Text: रतावानं रतायवो यज्ञस्य साधनं गिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtāvānaṃ ṛtāyavo yajñasya sādhanaṃ ghirā |
Translation: 9 Him, true to Law, who perfecteth the sacrifice,. Law-loving ones!

Sanskit Text: उपो एनं जुजुषुर्नमसस पदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upo enaṃ jujuṣurnamasas pade ||
Translation: Ye with your song have gratified in the place of prayer.

Sanskit Text: अछा नो अङगिरस्तमं यज्ञासो यन्तु संयतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā no aṅghirastamaṃ yajñāso yantu saṃyataḥ |
Translation: 10 May all our sacrifices go to him the truest Aṅgiras,

Sanskit Text: होता यो अस्ति विक्ष्वा यशस्तमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotā yo asti vikṣvā yaśastamaḥ ||
Translation: Who is among mankind the most illustrious Priest.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने तव तये अजरेन्धानासो बर्हद भाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne tava tye ajarendhānāso bṛhad bhāḥ |
Translation: 11 Imperishable Agni, thine are all these high enkindled lights,

Sanskit Text: अश्वा इव वर्षणस्तविषीयवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvā iva vṛṣaṇastaviṣīyavaḥ ||
Translation: Like horses and like stallions showing forth their strength.

Sanskit Text: स तवं न ऊर्जां पते रयिं रास्व सुवीर्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvaṃ na ūrjāṃ pate rayiṃ rāsva suvīryam |
Translation: 12 So give us, Lord of Power and Might, riches combined with hero strength,

Sanskit Text: पराव नस्तोके तनये समत्स्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāva nastoke tanaye samatsvā ||
Translation: And guard us with our sons and grand. sons in our frays.

Sanskit Text: यद वा उ विश्पतिः शितः सुप्रीतो मनुषो विसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā u viśpatiḥ śitaḥ suprīto manuṣo visi |
Translation: 13 Soon as the eager Lord of men is friendly unto Manti's race,

Sanskit Text: विश्वेदग्निः परति रक्षांसि सेधति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvedaghniḥ prati rakṣāṃsi sedhati ||
Translation: Agni averteth from us all the demon host.

Sanskit Text: शरुष्ट्यग्ने नवस्य मे सतोमस्य वीर विश्पते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śruṣṭyaghne navasya me stomasya vīra viśpate |
Translation: 14 O Hero Agni, Lord of men, on hearing this new laud of mine,

Sanskit Text: नि मायिनस्तपुष रक्षसो दह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni māyinastapuṣa rakṣaso daha ||
Translation: Burn down the Rākṣasas, enchanters, with thy flame.

Sanskit Text: न तस्य मायया चन रिपुरीशीत मर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na tasya māyayā cana ripurīśīta martyaḥ |
Translation: 15 No mortal foe can e’er prevail by arts of magic over him

Sanskit Text: यो अग्नये ददाश हव्यदातिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo aghnaye dadāśa havyadātibhiḥ ||
Translation: Who serveth Agni well with sacrificial gifts.

Sanskit Text: वयश्वस्त्वा वसुविदमुक्षण्युरप्रीणाद रषिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyaśvastvā vasuvidamukṣaṇyuraprīṇād ṛṣiḥ |
Translation: 16 Vyaśva the sage, who sought the Bull, hath won thee, finder of good things:

Sanskit Text: महो रयेतमु तवा समिधीमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maho rayetamu tvā samidhīmahi ||
Translation: As such may we enkindle thee for ample wealth.

Sanskit Text: उशना कव्यस्त्वा नि होतारमसादयत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uśanā kavyastvā ni hotāramasādayat |
Translation: 17 Uśanā Kāvya stablished thee, O Agni, as Invoking Priest:

Sanskit Text: आयजिं तवा मनवेजातवेदसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āyajiṃ tvā manavejātavedasam ||
Translation: Thee, Jātavedas, Sacrificing Priest for man.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे हि तवा सजोषसो देवासो दूतमक्रत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve hi tvā sajoṣaso devāso dūtamakrata |
Translation: 18 All Deities of one accord appointed thee their messenger:

Sanskit Text: शरुष्टी देव परथमो यज्ञियो भुवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śruṣṭī deva prathamo yajñiyo bhuvaḥ ||
Translation: Thou, God, through hearing, hadst first claim to sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: इमं घा वीरो अम्र्तं दूतं कर्ण्वीत मर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ ghā vīro amṛtaṃ dūtaṃ kṛṇvīta martyaḥ |
Translation: 19 Him may the mortal hero make his own immortal messenger.

Sanskit Text: पावकंक्र्ष्णवर्तनिं विहायसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāvakaṃkṛṣṇavartaniṃ vihāyasam ||
Translation: Far-spreading, Purifier, him whose path is black.

Sanskit Text: तं हुवेम यतस्रुचः सुभासं शुक्रशोचिषम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ huvema yatasrucaḥ subhāsaṃ śukraśociṣam |
Translation: 20 With lifted ladles let us call him splendid with his brilliant flame,

Sanskit Text: विशामग्निमजरं परत्नमीड्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśāmaghnimajaraṃ pratnamīḍyam ||
Translation: Men's ancient Agni, wasting not, adorable.

Sanskit Text: यो अस्मै हव्यदातिभिराहुतिं मर्तो.अविधत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo asmai havyadātibhirāhutiṃ marto.avidhat |
Translation: 21 The man who pays the worship due to him with sacrificial gifts

Sanskit Text: भूरि पोषंस धत्ते वीरवद यशः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūri poṣaṃsa dhatte vīravad yaśaḥ ||
Translation: Obtains both plenteous nourishment and hero fame.

Sanskit Text: परथमं जातवेदसमग्निं यज्ञेषु पूर्व्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prathamaṃ jātavedasamaghniṃ yajñeṣu pūrvyam |
Translation: 22 To Jātavedas Agni, chief in sacrifices, first of all

Sanskit Text: परति सरुगेति नमसा हविष्मती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati srugheti namasā haviṣmatī ||
Translation: With homage goes the ladle rich with sacred gifts.

Sanskit Text: आभिर्विधेमाग्नये जयेष्ठाभिर्व्यश्ववत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ābhirvidhemāghnaye jyeṣṭhābhirvyaśvavat |
Translation: 23 Even as Vyatya did, may we with these most high and liberal hymns

Sanskit Text: मंहिष्ठाभिर्मतिभिः शुक्रशोचिषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maṃhiṣṭhābhirmatibhiḥ śukraśociṣe ||
Translation: Pay worship unto Agni of the splendid flame.

Sanskit Text: नूनमर्च विहायसे सतोमेभिः सथूरयूपवत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nūnamarca vihāyase stomebhiḥ sthūrayūpavat |
Translation: 24 Now sing, as Sthurayupa sang, with lands to him who spreadeth far,

Sanskit Text: रषे वैयश्वदम्यायाग्नये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṣe vaiyaśvadamyāyāghnaye ||
Translation: To Agni of the home, O Ṛṣi, Vyaśva's son.

Sanskit Text: अतिथिं मानुषाणां सूनुं वनस्पतीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atithiṃ mānuṣāṇāṃ sūnuṃ vanaspatīnām |
Translation: 25 As welcome guest of human kind, as offspring of the forest kings,

Sanskit Text: विप्रा अग्निमवसे परत्नमीळते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viprā aghnimavase pratnamīḷate ||
Translation: The sages worship ancient Agni for his aid.

Sanskit Text: महो विश्वानभि षतो.अभि हव्यानि मानुषा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: maho viśvānabhi ṣato.abhi havyāni mānuṣā |
Translation: 26 For men's oblations brought to him who is the mighty Lord of all,

Sanskit Text: अग्ने नि षत्सि नमसाधि बर्हिषि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne ni ṣatsi namasādhi barhiṣi ||
Translation: Sit, Agni, mid our homage, on the sacred grass.

Sanskit Text: वंस्वा नो वार्या पुरु वंस्व रायः पुरुस्प्र्हः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaṃsvā no vāryā puru vaṃsva rāyaḥ puruspṛhaḥ |
Translation: 27 Grant us abundant. treasures, grant the opulence which many crave,

Sanskit Text: सुवीर्यस्य परजावतो यशस्वतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvīryasya prajāvato yaśasvataḥ ||
Translation: With store of heroes, progeny, and high renown.

Sanskit Text: तवं वरो सुषाम्णे.अग्ने जनाय चोदय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ varo suṣāmṇe.aghne janāya codaya |
Translation: 28 Agni, Most Youthful of the Gods, send evermore the gift of wealth

Sanskit Text: सदा वसो रातिं यविष्ठ शश्वते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadā vaso rātiṃ yaviṣṭha śaśvate ||
Translation: Unto Varosusaman and to all his folk.

Sanskit Text: तवं हि सुप्रतूरसि तवं नो गोमतीरिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hi supratūrasi tvaṃ no ghomatīriṣaḥ |
Translation: 29 A mighty Conqueror art thou, O Agni, so disclose to us

Sanskit Text: महो रायः सातिमग्ने अपा वर्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maho rāyaḥ sātimaghne apā vṛdhi ||
Translation: Food in our herds of kine and gain of ample wealth.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने तवं यशा अस्या मित्रावरुणा वह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne tvaṃ yaśā asyā mitrāvaruṇā vaha |
Translation: 30 Thou, Agni, art a glorious God: bring hither Mitra, Varuṇa,

Sanskit Text: रतावाना सम्राजा पूतदक्षसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtāvānā samrājā pūtadakṣasā ||
Translation: Imperial Sovrans, holy-minded, true to Law.

Sanskit Text: ता वां विश्वस्य गोपा देवा देवेषु यज्ञिय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā vāṃ viśvasya ghopā devā deveṣu yajñiya |
Translation: 1. I WORSHIP you who guard this All, Gods, holiest among the Gods,

Sanskit Text: रतावाना यजसे पुतदक्षसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtāvānā yajase putadakṣasā ||
Translation: You, faithful to the Law, whose power is sanctified.

Sanskit Text: मित्रा तना न रथ्या वरुणो यश्च सुक्रतुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitrā tanā na rathyā varuṇo yaśca sukratuḥ |
Translation: 2 So, too, like charioteers are they, Mitra and sapient Varuṇa,

Sanskit Text: सनात सुजाता तनया धर्तव्रता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanāt sujātā tanayā dhṛtavratā ||
Translation: Sons high-born from of old, whose holy laws stand fast.

Sanskit Text: ता माता विश्ववेदसासुर्याय परमहसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā mātā viśvavedasāsuryāya pramahasā |
Translation: 3 These Twain, possessors of all wealth, most glorious, for supremest sway

Sanskit Text: महि जजानादितिरतावरी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahi jajānāditirtāvarī ||
Translation: Aditi, Mighty Mother, true to Law, brought forth.

Sanskit Text: महान्ता मित्रावरुणा सम्राजा देवावसुरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahāntā mitrāvaruṇā samrājā devāvasurā |
Translation: 4 Great Varuṇa and Mitra, Gods, Asuras and imperial Lords,

Sanskit Text: रतावानाव्र्तमा घोषतो बर्हत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtāvānāvṛtamā ghoṣato bṛhat ||
Translation: True to Eternal Law proclaim the high decree.

Sanskit Text: नपाता शवसो महः सूनू दक्षस्य सुक्रतु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: napātā śavaso mahaḥ sūnū dakṣasya sukratu |
Translation: 5 The offspring of a lofty Power, Dakṣa's Two Sons exceeding strong,

Sanskit Text: सर्प्रदानू इषो वास्त्वधि कषितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sṛpradānū iṣo vāstvadhi kṣitaḥ ||
Translation: Who, Lords of flowing rain, dwell in the place of food.

Sanskit Text: सं या दानूनि येमथुर्दिव्याः पार्थिवीरिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yā dānūni yemathurdivyāḥ pārthivīriṣaḥ |
Translation: 6 Ye who have gathered up your gifts, celestial and terrestrial food,

Sanskit Text: नभस्वतीरा वां चरन्तु वर्ष्टयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nabhasvatīrā vāṃ carantu vṛṣṭayaḥ ||
Translation: Let your rain come to us fraught with the mist of heaven.

Sanskit Text: अधि या बर्हतो दिवो.अभि यूथेव पश्यतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi yā bṛhato divo.abhi yūtheva paśyataḥ |
Translation: 7 The Twain, who from the lofty sky seem to look down on herds below,

Sanskit Text: रतावाना सम्राजा नमसे हिता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtāvānā samrājā namase hitā ||
Translation: Holy, imperial Lords, are set to be revered.

Sanskit Text: रतावाना नि षेदतुः साम्राज्याय सुक्रतू |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtāvānā ni ṣedatuḥ sāmrājyāya sukratū |
Translation: 8 They, true to Law, exceeding strong, have sat them down for savran rule:

Sanskit Text: धर्तव्रता कषत्रिया कषत्रमशतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhṛtavratā kṣatriyā kṣatramaśatuḥ ||
Translation: Princes whose laws stand fast, they have obtained their sway.

Sanskit Text: अक्ष्णश्चिद गातुवित्तरनुल्बणेन चक्षसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: akṣṇaścid ghātuvittaranulbaṇena cakṣasā |
Translation: 9 Pathfinders even better than the eye, with unobstructed sight,

Sanskit Text: नि चिन मिषन्ता निचिरा नि चिक्यतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni cin miṣantā nicirā ni cikyatuḥ ||
Translation: Even when they close their lids, observant, they perceive.

Sanskit Text: उत नो देव्यदितिरुरुष्यतां नासत्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta no devyaditiruruṣyatāṃ nāsatyā |
Translation: 10 So may the Goddess Aditi, may the Nāsatyas guard us well,

Sanskit Text: उरुष्यन्तु मरुतो वर्द्धशवसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uruṣyantu maruto vṛddhaśavasaḥ ||
Translation: The Martits guard us well,.endowed with mighty strength.

Sanskit Text: ते नो नावमुरुष्यत दिवा नक्तं सुदानवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te no nāvamuruṣyata divā naktaṃ sudānavaḥ |
Translation: 11 Do ye, O Bounteous Gods, protect our dwelling lace by day and night:

Sanskit Text: अरिष्यन्तो निपायुभिः सचेमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ariṣyanto nipāyubhiḥ sacemahi ||
Translation: With you for our defenders may we go unharmed.

Sanskit Text: अघ्नते विष्णवे वयमरिष्यन्तः सुदानवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnate viṣṇave vayamariṣyantaḥ sudānave |
Translation: 12 May we, unharmed, serve bountiful Viṣṇu, the God who slayeth none:

Sanskit Text: शरुधि सवयावन सिन्धो पूर्वचित्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrudhi svayāvan sindho pūrvacittaye ||
Translation: Self-moving Sindhu hear and be the first to mark.

Sanskit Text: तद वार्यं वर्णीमहे वरिष्ठं गोपयत्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad vāryaṃ vṛṇīmahe variṣṭhaṃ ghopayatyam |
Translation: 13 This sure protection we elect, desirable and reaching far,

Sanskit Text: मित्रो यत पान्ति वरुणो यदर्यमा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitro yat pānti varuṇo yadaryamā ||
Translation: Which Mitra, Varuṇa, and Aryaman afford.

Sanskit Text: उत नः सिन्धुरपां तन मरुतस्तदश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta naḥ sindhurapāṃ tan marutastadaśvinā |
Translation: 14 And may the Sindhu of the floods, the Maruts, and the ASvin Pair,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो विष्णुर्मीढ्वांसः सजोषसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro viṣṇurmīḍhvāṃsaḥ sajoṣasaḥ ||
Translation: Boon Indra, and boon Viṣṇu have one mind with us.

Sanskit Text: ते हि षमा वनुषो नरो.अभिमातिं कयस्य चित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te hi ṣmā vanuṣo naro.abhimātiṃ kayasya cit |
Translation: 15 Because these warring Heroes stay the enmity of every foe,

Sanskit Text: तिग्मं नक्षोदः परतिघ्नन्ति भूर्णयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tighmaṃ nakṣodaḥ pratighnanti bhūrṇayaḥ ||
Translation: As the fierce water-flood repels the furious ones.

Sanskit Text: अयमेक इत्था पुरूरु चष्टे वि विष्पतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayameka itthā purūru caṣṭe vi viṣpatiḥ |
Translation: 16 Here this one God, the Lord of men, looks forth exceeding far and wide:

Sanskit Text: तस्य वरतान्यनु वश्चरमसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya vratānyanu vaścaramasi ||
Translation: And we, for your advantage, keep his holy laws.

Sanskit Text: अनु पूर्वाण्योक्या साम्राज्यस्य सश्चिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu pūrvāṇyokyā sāmrājyasya saścima |
Translation: 17 We keep the old accustomed laws, the statutes of supremacy,

Sanskit Text: मित्रस्य वरता वरुणस्य दिर्घश्रुत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitrasya vratā varuṇasya dirghaśrut ||
Translation: The Iong-known laws of Mitra and of Varuṇa.

Sanskit Text: परि यो रश्मिना दिवो.अन्तान ममे पर्थिव्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari yo raśminā divo.antān mame pṛthivyāḥ |
Translation: 18 He who hath measured with his ray the boundaries of heaven and earth,

Sanskit Text: उभे आ पप्रौरोदसी महित्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhe ā papraurodasī mahitvā ||
Translation: And with his majesty hath filled the two worlds full,

Sanskit Text: उदु षय शरणे दिवो जयोतिरयंस्त सूर्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udu ṣya śaraṇe divo jyotirayaṃsta sūryaḥ |
Translation: 19 Sūrya hath spread his light aloft up to the region of the sky,

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्न शुक्रः समिधान आहुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirna śukraḥ samidhāna āhutaḥ ||
Translation: Like Agni all aflame when gifts are offered him.

Sanskit Text: वचो दीर्घप्रसद्मनीशे वाजस्य गोमतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaco dīrghaprasadmanīśe vājasya ghomataḥ |
Translation: 20 With him who sits afar the word is lord of food that comes from kine,

Sanskit Text: ईशे हि पित्वोऽविषस्य दावने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: īśe hi pitvo'viṣasya dāvane ||
Translation: Controller of the gift of unempoisoned food.

Sanskit Text: तत सूर्यं रोदसी उभे दोषा वस्तोरुप बरुवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat sūryaṃ rodasī ubhe doṣā vastorupa bruve |
Translation: 21 So unto Sūrya, Heaven, and Earth at morning and at eve I speak.

Sanskit Text: भोजेष्वस्मानभ्युच्चरा सदा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhojeṣvasmānabhyuccarā sadā ||
Translation: Bringing enjoyments ever rise thou up for us.

Sanskit Text: रज्रमुक्षण्यायने रजतं हरयाणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛjramukṣaṇyāyane rajataṃ harayāṇe |
Translation: 22 From Uksanyayana a bay, from Harayana a white steed,

Sanskit Text: रथं युक्तमसनाम सुषामणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathaṃ yuktamasanāma suṣāmaṇi ||
Translation: And from Susaman we obtained a hamessed car.

Sanskit Text: ता मे अश्व्यानां हरीणां नितोशना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā me aśvyānāṃ harīṇāṃ nitośanā |
Translation: 23 These two shall bring me further gain of troops of tawny-coloured steeds,

Sanskit Text: उतो नु कर्त्व्यानां नर्वाहसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto nu kṛtvyānāṃ nṛvāhasā ||
Translation: The carriers shall they be of active men of war.

Sanskit Text: समदभीषू कशावन्ता विप्रा नविष्ठया मती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: smadabhīṣū kaśāvantā viprā naviṣṭhayā matī |
Translation: 24 And the two sages have I gained who hold the reins and bear the whip,

Sanskit Text: महो वाजिनावर्वन्ता सचासनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maho vājināvarvantā sacāsanam ||
Translation: And the two great strong coursers, with my newest song.

Sanskit Text: युवोरु षू रथं हुवे सधस्तुत्याय सुरिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvoru ṣū rathaṃ huve sadhastutyāya suriṣu |
Translation: 1. I CALL your chariot to receive united praise mid princely men,

Sanskit Text: अतुर्तदक्षाव्र्षणा वर्षण्वसू ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aturtadakṣāvṛṣaṇā vṛṣaṇvasū ||
Translation: Strong Gods who pour down wealth, of never vanquished might!

Sanskit Text: युवं वरो सुषाम्णे महे तने नासत्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ varo suṣāmṇe mahe tane nāsatyā |
Translation: 2 Ye to Varosusaman come, Nāsatyas, for this glorious rite.

Sanskit Text: अवोभिर्यथो वर्षण वर्षण्वसू ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avobhiryatho vṛṣaṇa vṛṣaṇvasū ||
Translation: With your protecting aid. Strong Gods, who pour down wealth.

Sanskit Text: ता वामद्य हवामहे हव्येभिर्वजिनीवसू |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā vāmadya havāmahe havyebhirvajinīvasū |
Translation: 3 So with oblations we invoke you, rich in ample wealth, to-day,

Sanskit Text: पूर्वीरिष इषयन्तावति कषपः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvīriṣa iṣayantāvati kṣapaḥ ||
Translation: When night hath passed, O ye who send us plenteous food.

Sanskit Text: आ वां वाहिष्ठो अश्विना रथो यातु शरुतो नर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ vāhiṣṭho aśvinā ratho yātu śruto nara |
Translation: O Aśvins, Heroes, let your car, famed, best to travel, come to us,

Sanskit Text: उप सतोमान तुरस्य दर्शथः शरिये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa stomān turasya darśathaḥ śriye ||
Translation: And, for his glory, mark your zealous servant's lauds.

Sanskit Text: जुहुराणा चिदश्विना मन्येथां वर्षण्वसू |
Sanskrit Transliteration: juhurāṇā cidaśvinā manyethāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū |
Translation: 5 Aśvins, who send us precious gifts, even when offended, think of him:

Sanskit Text: युवं हि रुद्रा पर्षथो अति दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ hi rudrā parṣatho ati dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: For ye, O Rudras, lead us safe beyond our foes.

Sanskit Text: दस्रा हि विश्वमानुषं मक्षूभिः परिदीयथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dasrā hi viśvamānuṣaṃ makṣūbhiḥ paridīyathaḥ |
Translation: 6 For, Wonder-Workers, with fleet steeds ye fly completely round this All,

Sanskit Text: धियंजिन्वा मधुवर्णा शुभस पती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiyaṃjinvā madhuvarṇā śubhas patī ||
Translation: Stirring our thoughts, ye Lords of splendour, honey-hued.

Sanskit Text: उप नो यातमश्विना राया विश्वपुषा सह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa no yātamaśvinā rāyā viśvapuṣā saha |
Translation: 7 With all-sustaining opulence, Aśvins, come hitherward to us,

Sanskit Text: मघवाना सुवीरावनपच्युता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maghavānā suvīrāvanapacyutā ||
Translation: Ye rich and noble Heroes, ne’er to be o’erthrown.

Sanskit Text: आ मे अस्य परतीव्यमिन्द्रनासत्या गतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā me asya pratīvyamindranāsatyā ghatam |
Translation: 8 To welcome this mine offering, O ye Indra-like Nāsatyas, come

Sanskit Text: देवा देवेभिरद्य सचनस्तमा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devā devebhiradya sacanastamā ||
Translation: As Gods of best accord this day with other Gods.

Sanskit Text: वयं हि वां हवामह उक्षण्यन्तो वयश्ववत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ hi vāṃ havāmaha ukṣaṇyanto vyaśvavat |
Translation: 9 For we, like Vyaśva, lifting up our voice like oxen, call on you:

Sanskit Text: सुमतिभिरुप विप्राविहा गतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sumatibhirupa viprāvihā ghatam ||
Translation: With all your loving kindness, Sages, come to us.

Sanskit Text: अश्विना सव रषे सतुहि कुवित ते शरवतो हवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvinā sv ṛṣe stuhi kuvit te śravato havam |
Translation: 10 O Ṛṣi, laud the Aśvins well. Will they not listen to thy call?

Sanskit Text: नेदीयसः कूळयातः पणीन्रुत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nedīyasaḥ kūḷayātaḥ paṇīnruta ||
Translation: Will they not burn the Paṇis who are nearer them?

Sanskit Text: वैयश्वस्य शरुतं नरोतो मे अस्य वेदथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiyaśvasya śrutaṃ naroto me asya vedathaḥ |
Translation: 11 O Heroes, listen to the son of Vyaśva, and regard me here,

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā varuṇo mitro aryamā ||
Translation: Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, of one accord.

Sanskit Text: युवादत्तस्य धिष्ण्या युवानीतस्य सूरिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvādattasya dhiṣṇyā yuvānītasya sūribhiḥ |
Translation: 12 Gods whom we yearn for, of your gifts, of what ye bring to us, bestow

Sanskit Text: अहर-अहर्व्र्षण मह्यं शिक्षतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahar-aharvṛṣaṇa mahyaṃ śikṣatam ||
Translation: By princes' hands on me, ye Mighty, day by day.

Sanskit Text: यो वां यज्ञेभिराव्र्तो.अधिवस्त्र वधूरिव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vāṃ yajñebhirāvṛto.adhivastra vadhūriva |
Translation: 13 Him whom your sacrifices clothe, even as a woman with her robe,

Sanskit Text: सपर्यन्त शुभे चक्राते अश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saparyanta śubhe cakrāte aśvinā ||
Translation: The Aśvins help to glory honouring him well.

Sanskit Text: यो वामुरुव्यचस्तमं चिकेतति नर्पाय्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vāmuruvyacastamaṃ ciketati nṛpāyyam |
Translation: 14 Whoso regards your care of men as succour widest in its reach,

Sanskit Text: वर्तिरश्विना परि यातमस्मयू ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vartiraśvinā pari yātamasmayū ||
Translation: About his dwelling go, ye Aśvins, loving us.

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं सु वर्षण्वसू यातं वर्तिर्न्र्पय्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ su vṛṣaṇvasū yātaṃ vartirnṛpayyam |
Translation: 15 Come to us ye who pour down wealth, come to the home which men must guard:

Sanskit Text: विषुद्रुहेव यज्ञमूहथुर्गिरा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viṣudruheva yajñamūhathurghirā ||
Translation: Like shafts, ye are made meet for sacrifice by song.

Sanskit Text: वाहिष्ठो वां हवानां सतोमो दूतो हुवन नरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāhiṣṭho vāṃ havānāṃ stomo dūto huvan narā |
Translation: 16 Most fetching of all calls, the laud, as envoy, Heroes, called to you

Sanskit Text: युवाभ्यां भूत्वश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvābhyāṃ bhūtvaśvinā ||
Translation: Be it your own, O Aśvin Pair.

Sanskit Text: यददो दिवो अर्णव इषो व मदथो गर्हे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadado divo arṇava iṣo va madatho ghṛhe |
Translation: 17 Be ye in yonder sea of heaven, or joying in the home of food,

Sanskit Text: शरुतमिन मे अमर्त्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrutamin me amartyā ||
Translation: Listen to me, Immortal Ones.

Sanskit Text: उत सया शवेतयावरी वाहिष्ठा वां नदीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta syā śvetayāvarī vāhiṣṭhā vāṃ nadīnām |
Translation: 18 This river with his lucid flow attracts you, more than all the streams,—

Sanskit Text: सिन्धुर्हिरण्यवर्तनिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sindhurhiraṇyavartaniḥ ||
Translation: Even Sindhu with his path of gold.

Sanskit Text: समदेतय सुकीर्त्याश्विना शवेतया धिया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: smadetaya sukīrtyāśvinā śvetayā dhiyā |
Translation: 19 O Aśvins, with that glorious fame come hither, through our brilliant song,

Sanskit Text: वहेथे शुभ्रयावाना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vahethe śubhrayāvānā ||
Translation: Come ye whose ways are marked with light.

Sanskit Text: युक्ष्वा हि तवं रथासहा युवस्व पोष्या वसो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yukṣvā hi tvaṃ rathāsahā yuvasva poṣyā vaso |
Translation: 20 Harness the steeds who draw the car, O Vasu, bring the well-fed pair.

Sanskit Text: आन नो वायो मधु पिबास्माकं सवना गहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ān no vāyo madhu pibāsmākaṃ savanā ghahi ||
Translation: O Vāyu, drink thou of our meath: come unto our drink-offerings.

Sanskit Text: तव वायव रतस्पते तवष्टुर्जामातरद्भुत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava vāyav ṛtaspate tvaṣṭurjāmātaradbhuta |
Translation: 21 Wonderful Vāyu, Lord of Right, thou who art Tvaṣṭar's son-in-law,

Sanskit Text: अवांस्या वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avāṃsyā vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: Thy saving succour we elect.

Sanskit Text: तवष्टुर्जामातरं वयमीशानं राय ईमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṣṭurjāmātaraṃ vayamīśānaṃ rāya īmahe |
Translation: 22 To Tvaṣṭar's son-in-law we pray for wealth whereof he hath control:

Sanskit Text: सुतावन्तो वयुं दयुम्ना जनासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sutāvanto vayuṃ dyumnā janāsaḥ ||
Translation: For glory we seek vayu, men with juice effused.

Sanskit Text: वायो याहि शिवा दिवो वहस्व सु सवश्व्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāyo yāhi śivā divo vahasva su svaśvyam |
Translation: 23 From heaven, auspicious Vāyu, come drive hither with thy noble steeds:

Sanskit Text: वहस्व महःप्र्थुपक्षसा रथे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vahasva mahaḥpṛthupakṣasā rathe ||
Translation: Come on thy mighty car with wide-extending seat.

Sanskit Text: तवां हि सुप्सरस्तमं नर्षदनेषु हूमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ hi supsarastamaṃ nṛṣadaneṣu hūmahe |
Translation: 24 We call thee to the homes of men, thee wealthiest in noble food,

Sanskit Text: गरावाणं नाश्वप्र्ष्ठं मंहना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghrāvāṇaṃ nāśvapṛṣṭhaṃ maṃhanā ||
Translation: And liberal as a press-stone with a horse's back.

Sanskit Text: स तवं नो देव मनसा वायो मन्दानो अग्रियः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvaṃ no deva manasā vāyo mandāno aghriyaḥ |
Translation: 25 So, glad and joyful in thine heart, do thou, God, Vāyu, first of all

Sanskit Text: कर्धि वाजानपो धियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛdhi vājānapo dhiyaḥ ||
Translation: Vouchsafe us water, strength, and thought.

Sanskit Text: अग्निरुक्थे पुरोहितो गरावाणो बर्हिरध्वरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirukthe purohito ghrāvāṇo barhiradhvare |
Translation: 1. CHEIF Priest is Agni at the laud, as stones and grass at sacrifice:

Sanskit Text: रचा यामि मरुतो बरह्मणस पतिं देवानवो वरेण्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛcā yāmi maruto brahmaṇas patiṃ devānavo vareṇyam ||
Translation: With song I seek the Maruts, Brahmaṇaspati, Gods for help much to be desired.

Sanskit Text: आ पशुं गासि पर्थिवीं वनस्पतीनुषासा नक्तमोषधीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā paśuṃ ghāsi pṛthivīṃ vanaspatīnuṣāsā naktamoṣadhīḥ |
Translation: 2 I sing to cattle and to Earth, to trees, to Dawns, to Night, to plants.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे च नो वसवो विश्ववेदसो धीनां भूत परावितारः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve ca no vasavo viśvavedaso dhīnāṃ bhūta prāvitāraḥ ||
Translation: O all ye Vasus, ye possessors of all wealth, be ye the furtherers of our thoughts.

Sanskit Text: पर सू न एत्वध्वरो.अग्ना देवेषु पूर्व्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sū na etvadhvaro.aghnā deveṣu pūrvyaḥ |
Translation: 3 Forth go, with Agni, to the Gods our sacrifice of ancient use,

Sanskit Text: आदित्येषु पर वरुणे धर्तव्रते मरुत्सु विश्वभानुषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityeṣu pra varuṇe dhṛtavrate marutsu viśvabhānuṣu ||
Translation: To the Ādityas, Varuṇa whose Law stands fast, and the all-lightening Marut troop.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे हि षमा मनवे विश्ववेदसो भुवन वर्धे रिशादसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve hi ṣmā manave viśvavedaso bhuvan vṛdhe riśādasaḥ |
Translation: 4 Lords of all wealth, may they be strengtheners of man, destroyers of his enemies.

Sanskit Text: अरिष्टेभिः पायुभिर्विश्ववेदसो यन्ता नो.अव्र्कं छर्दिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ariṣṭebhiḥ pāyubhirviśvavedaso yantā no.avṛkaṃ chardiḥ ||
Translation: Lords of all wealth, do ye, with guards which none may harm, preserve our dwelling free from foes.

Sanskit Text: आ नो अद्य समनसो गन्ता विश्वे सजोषसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no adya samanaso ghantā viśve sajoṣasaḥ |
Translation: 5 Come to us with one mind to-day, come to us all with one accord,

Sanskit Text: रचा गिरा मरुतो देव्यदिते सदने पस्त्ये महि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛcā ghirā maruto devyadite sadane pastye mahi ||
Translation: Maruts with holy song, and, Goddess Aditi, Mighty One, to our house and home.

Sanskit Text: अभि परिया मरुतो या वो अश्व्या हव्या मित्र परयाथन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi priyā maruto yā vo aśvyā havyā mitra prayāthana |
Translation: 6 Send us delightful things, ye Maruts, on your steeds: come ye, O Mitra, to our gifts.

Sanskit Text: आबर्हिरिन्द्रो वरुणस्तुरा नर आदित्यासो सदन्तु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ābarhirindro varuṇasturā nara ādityāso sadantu naḥ ||
Translation: Let Indra, Varuṇa, and the Ādityas sit, swift Heroes, on our sacred grass.

Sanskit Text: वयं वो वर्क्तबर्हिषो हितप्रयस आनुषक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ vo vṛktabarhiṣo hitaprayasa ānuṣak |
Translation: 7 We who have trimmed the grass for you, and set the banquet in array,

Sanskit Text: सुतसोमासो वरुण हवामहे मनुष्वदिद्धाग्नयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sutasomāso varuṇa havāmahe manuṣvadiddhāghnayaḥ ||
Translation: And pressed the Soma, call you, Varuina, like men, with sacrificial fires aflame.

Sanskit Text: आ पर यात मरुतो विष्णो अश्विना पूषन माकीनया धिया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā pra yāta maruto viṣṇo aśvinā pūṣan mākīnayā dhiyā |
Translation: 8 O Maruts, Visinu, Aśvins, Pūṣan, haste away with minds turned hitherward to Me.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र आ यातु परथमः सनिष्युभिर्व्र्षा यो वर्त्रहा गर्णे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra ā yātu prathamaḥ saniṣyubhirvṛṣā yo vṛtrahā ghṛṇe ||
Translation: Let the Strong Indra, famed as Vṛtra's slayer, come first with the winners of the spoil.

Sanskit Text: वि नो देवासो अद्रुहो.अछिद्रं शर्म यछत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi no devāso adruho.achidraṃ śarma yachata |
Translation: 9 Ye Guileless Gods, bestow on us a refuge strong on every side,

Sanskit Text: न यद दूराद वसवो नू चिदन्तितो वरूथमादधर्षति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yad dūrād vasavo nū cidantito varūthamādadharṣati ||
Translation: A sure protection, Vasus, unassailable from near at hand or from afar.

Sanskit Text: अस्ति हि वः सजात्यं रिशादसो देवासो अस्त्याप्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asti hi vaḥ sajātyaṃ riśādaso devāso astyāpyam |
Translation: 10 Kinship have I with you, and close alliance O ye Gods, destroyers of our foes.

Sanskit Text: पर णः पूर्वस्मै सुविताय वोचत मक्षू सुम्नाय नव्यसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ṇaḥ pūrvasmai suvitāya vocata makṣū sumnāya navyase ||
Translation: Call us to our prosperity of former days, and soon to new klicity.

Sanskit Text: इदा हि व उपस्तुतिमिदा वामस्य भक्तये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idā hi va upastutimidā vāmasya bhaktaye |
Translation: 11 For now have I sent forth to you, that I may win a fair reward,

Sanskit Text: उप वो विश्ववेदसो नमस्युरानस्र्क्ष्यन्यामिव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa vo viśvavedaso namasyurānasṛkṣyanyāmiva ||
Translation: Lords of all wealth, with homage, this my song of praise. like a milch-cow that faileth not.

Sanskit Text: उदु षय वः सविता सुप्रणीतयो.अस्थादूर्ध्वो वरेण्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udu ṣya vaḥ savitā supraṇītayo.asthādūrdhvo vareṇyaḥ |
Translation: 12 Excellent Savitar hath mounted up on high for you, ye sure and careful Guides.

Sanskit Text: नि दविपादश्चतुष्पादो अर्थिनो.अविश्रन पतयिष्णवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni dvipādaścatuṣpādo arthino.aviśran patayiṣṇavaḥ ||
Translation: Bipeds and quadrupeds, with several hopes and aims, and birds have settled to their tasks.

Sanskit Text: देवं-देवं वो.अवसे देवं-देवमभिष्टये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devaṃ-devaṃ vo.avase devaṃ-devamabhiṣṭaye |
Translation: 13 Singing their praise with God-like thought let us invoke each God for grace,

Sanskit Text: देवं-देवं हुवेम वाजसातये गर्णन्तो देव्या धिया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devaṃ-devaṃ huvema vājasātaye ghṛṇanto devyā dhiyā ||
Translation: Each God to bring you help, each God to strengthen you.

Sanskit Text: देवासो हि षमा मनवे समन्यवो विश्वे साकं सरातयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāso hi ṣmā manave samanyavo viśve sākaṃ sarātayaḥ |
Translation: 14 For of one spirit are the Gods with mortal man, co-sharers all of gracious gifts.

Sanskit Text: ते नो अद्य ते अपरं तुचे तु नो भवन्तु वरिवोविदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te no adya te aparaṃ tuce tu no bhavantu varivovidaḥ ||
Translation: May they increase our strength hereafter and to-day, providing case and ample room.

Sanskit Text: पर वः शंसाम्यद्रुहः संस्थ उपस्तुतीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vaḥ śaṃsāmyadruhaḥ saṃstha upastutīnām |
Translation: 15 I laud you, O ye Guileless Gods, here where we meet to render praise.

Sanskit Text: न तं धूर्तिर्वरुण मित्र मर्त्यं यो वो धामभ्यो.अविधत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na taṃ dhūrtirvaruṇa mitra martyaṃ yo vo dhāmabhyo.avidhat ||
Translation: None, Varuṇa and Mitra, harins the mortal, man who honours and obeys your laws.

Sanskit Text: पर स कषयं तिरते वि महीरिषो यो वो वराय दाशति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sa kṣayaṃ tirate vi mahīriṣo yo vo varāya dāśati |
Translation: 16 He makes his house endure, he gathers plenteous food who pays obedience to your will.

Sanskit Text: पर परजाभिर्जायते धर्मणस पर्यरिष्टः सर्व एधते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra prajābhirjāyate dharmaṇas paryariṣṭaḥ sarva edhate ||
Translation: Born in his sons anew he spreads as Law commands, and prospers every way unharmed.

Sanskit Text: रते स विन्दते युधः सुगेभिर्यात्यध्वनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛte sa vindate yudhaḥ sughebhiryātyadhvanaḥ |
Translation: 17 E’en without war he gathers wealth, and goes hisway on pleasant paths,

Sanskit Text: अर्यमा मित्रोवरुणः सरातयो यं तरायन्ते सजोषसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aryamā mitrovaruṇaḥ sarātayo yaṃ trāyante sajoṣasaḥ ||
Translation: Whom Mitra, Varuṇa and Aryaman protect, sharing the gift,of one accord.

Sanskit Text: अज्रे चिदस्मै कर्णुथा नयञ्चनं दुर्गे चिदा सुसरणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajre cidasmai kṛṇuthā nyañcanaṃ durghe cidā susaraṇam |
Translation: 18 E’en on the plain for him ye make a sloping path, an easy way where road is none:

Sanskit Text: एषा चिदस्मादशनिः परो नु सास्रेधन्ती वि नश्यतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣā cidasmādaśaniḥ paro nu sāsredhantī vi naśyatu ||
Translation: And far away from him the ineffectual shaft must vanish, shot at him in vain.

Sanskit Text: यदद्य सूर्य उद्यति परियक्षत्रा रतं दध |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadadya sūrya udyati priyakṣatrā ṛtaṃ dadha |
Translation: 19 If ye appoint the rite to-day, kind Rulers, when the Sun ascends,

Sanskit Text: यन निम्रुचि परबुधि विश्ववेदसो यद वा मध्यन्दिने दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yan nimruci prabudhi viśvavedaso yad vā madhyandine divaḥ ||
Translation: Lords of all wealth, at sunset or at wakingtime, or be it at the noon of day,

Sanskit Text: यद वाभिपित्वे असुरा रतं यते छर्दिर्येम वि दाशुषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vābhipitve asurā ṛtaṃ yate chardiryema vi dāśuṣe |
Translation: 20 Or, Asuras, when ye have sheltered the worshipper who goes to sacrifice, at eve

Sanskit Text: वयं तद वो वसवो विश्ववेदस उप सथेयाम मध्य आ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ tad vo vasavo viśvavedasa upa stheyāma madhya ā ||
Translation: may we, O Vasus, ye possessors of all wealth, come then into the midst of You.

Sanskit Text: यदद्य सूर उदिते यन मध्यन्दिन आतुचि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadadya sūra udite yan madhyandina ātuci |
Translation: 21 If ye to-day at sunrise, or at noon, or in the gloom of eve,

Sanskit Text: वामं धत्थ मनवे विश्ववेदसो जुह्वानाय परचेतसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāmaṃ dhattha manave viśvavedaso juhvānāya pracetase ||
Translation: Lords of all riches, give fair treasure to the man, the wise man who hath sacrificed,

Sanskit Text: वयं तद वः सम्राज आ वर्णीमहे पुत्रो न बहुपाय्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ tad vaḥ samrāja ā vṛṇīmahe putro na bahupāyyam |
Translation: 22 Then we, imperial Rulers, claim of you this boon, your wide protection, as a son.

Sanskit Text: अश्याम तदादित्या जुह्वतो हविर्येन वस्यो.अनशामहै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśyāma tadādityā juhvato haviryena vasyo.anaśāmahai ||
Translation: May we, Ādityas, offering holy gifts, obtain that which shall bring us greater bliss.

Sanskit Text: ये तरिंशति तरयस परो देवासो बर्हिरासदन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye triṃśati trayas paro devāso barhirāsadan |
Translation: 1. THE Thirty Gods and Three besides, whose seat hath been the sacred grass,

Sanskit Text: विदन्नहद्वितासनन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidannahadvitāsanan ||
Translation: From time of old have found and gained.

Sanskit Text: वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा समद्रातिषाचो अग्नयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: varuṇo mitro aryamā smadrātiṣāco aghnayaḥ |
Translation: 2 Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, Agnis, with Consorts, sending boons,

Sanskit Text: पत्नीवन्तो वषट्क्र्ताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: patnīvanto vaṣaṭkṛtāḥ ||
Translation: To whom our Vaṣaṭ! is addressed:

Sanskit Text: ते नो गोपा अपाच्यास्त उदक त इत्था नयक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te no ghopā apācyāsta udak ta itthā nyak |
Translation: 3 These are our guardians in the west, and northward here, and in the south,

Sanskit Text: पुरस्तात सर्वया विशा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purastāt sarvayā viśā ||
Translation: And on the cast, with all the tribe.

Sanskit Text: यथा वशन्ति देवास्तथेदसत तदेषां नकिरा मिनत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā vaśanti devāstathedasat tadeṣāṃ nakirā minat |
Translation: 4 Even as the Gods desire so verily shall it be. None minisheth this power of theirs,

Sanskit Text: अरावा चन मर्त्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arāvā cana martyaḥ ||
Translation: No demon, and no mortal

Sanskit Text: सप्तानां सप्त रष्टयः सप्त दयुम्नान्येषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saptānāṃ sapta ṛṣṭayaḥ sapta dyumnānyeṣām |
Translation: 5 The Seven carry seven spears; seven are the splendours they possess,

Sanskit Text: सप्तो अधि शरियो धिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sapto adhi śriyo dhire ||
Translation: And seven the glories they assume.

Sanskit Text: बभ्रुरेको विषुणः सूनरो युवाञ्ज्यङकते हिरण्ययम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: babhrureko viṣuṇaḥ sūnaro yuvāñjyaṅkte hiraṇyayam ||
Translation: 1. ONE is a youth brown, active, manifold he decks the golden one with ornament.

Sanskit Text: योनिमेक आ ससाद दयोतनो.अन्तर्देवेषु मेधिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yonimeka ā sasāda dyotano.antardeveṣu medhiraḥ ||
Translation: 2 Another, luminous, occupies the place of sacritice, Sage, among the Gods.

Sanskit Text: वाशीमेको बिभर्ति हस्त आयसीमन्तर्देवेषु निध्रुविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāśīmeko bibharti hasta āyasīmantardeveṣu nidhruviḥ ||
Translation: 3 One brandishes in his hand an iron knife, firm, in his seat amid the Deities.

Sanskit Text: वज्रमेको बिभर्ति हस्त आहितं तेन वर्त्राणि जिघ्नते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vajrameko bibharti hasta āhitaṃ tena vṛtrāṇi jighnate ||
Translation: 4 Another holds the thunderbolt, wherewith he slays the Vṛtras, resting in his hand.

Sanskit Text: तिग्ममेको बिभर्ति हस्त आयुधं शुचिरुग्रो जलाषभेषजः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tighmameko bibharti hasta āyudhaṃ śucirughro jalāṣabheṣajaḥ ||
Translation: 5 Another bears a pointed weapon: bright is he, and strong, with healing medicines.

Sanskit Text: पथ एकः पीपाय तस्करो यथा एष वेद निधीनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: patha ekaḥ pīpāya taskaro yathā eṣa veda nidhīnām ||
Translation: 6 Another, thief-like, watches well the ways, and knows the places where the treasures lie.

Sanskit Text: तरीण्येक उरुगायो वि चक्रमे यत्र देवासो मदन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trīṇyeka urughāyo vi cakrame yatra devāso madanti ||
Translation: 7 Another with his mighty stride hath made his three steps thither where the Gods rejoice.

Sanskit Text: विभिर्द्वा चरत एकया सह पर परवासेव वसतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vibhirdvā carata ekayā saha pra pravāseva vasataḥ ||
Translation: 8 Two with one Dame ride on with winged steeds, and journey forth like travellers on their way.

Sanskit Text: सदो दवा चक्राते उपमा दिवि सम्राजा सर्पिरासुती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sado dvā cakrāte upamā divi samrājā sarpirāsutī ||
Translation: 9 Two, highest, in the heavens have set their seat, worshipped with holy oil, imperial Kings.

Sanskit Text: अर्चन्त एके महि साम मन्वत तेन सूर्यमरोचयन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arcanta eke mahi sāma manvata tena sūryamarocayan ||
Translation: 10 Some, singing lauds, conceived the Sāma-hymn, great hymn whereby they caused the Sun to shine.

Sanskit Text: नहि वो अस्त्यर्भको देवासो न कुमारकः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi vo astyarbhako devāso na kumārakaḥ |
Translation: 1. NOT one of you, ye Gods, is small, none of you is a feeble child:

Sanskit Text: विश्वे सतोमहान्त इत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve satomahānta it ||
Translation: All of you, verily, are great.

Sanskit Text: इति सतुतासो असथा रिशादसो ये सथ तरयश्च तरिंशच्च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iti stutāso asathā riśādaso ye stha trayaśca triṃśacca |
Translation: 2 Thus be ye lauded, ye destroyers of the foe, ye Three-and-Thirty Deities,

Sanskit Text: मनोर्देवा यज्ञियासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manordevā yajñiyāsaḥ ||
Translation: The Gods of man, the Holy Ones.

Sanskit Text: ते नस्त्राध्वं ते.अवत त उ नो अधि वोचत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te nastrādhvaṃ te.avata ta u no adhi vocata |
Translation: 3 As such defend and succour us, with benedictions speak to us:

Sanskit Text: मा नः पथः पित्र्यान मानवादधि दूरं नैष्ट परावतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā naḥ pathaḥ pitryān mānavādadhi dūraṃ naiṣṭa parāvataḥ ||
Translation: Lead us not from our fathers' and from Manu's path into the distance far away.

Sanskit Text: ये देवास इह सथन विश्वे वैश्वानरा उत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye devāsa iha sthana viśve vaiśvānarā uta |
Translation: 4 Ye Deities who stay with us, and all ye Gods of all mankind,

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं शर्म सप्रथो गवे.अश्वाय यछत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ śarma sapratho ghave.aśvāya yachata ||
Translation: Give us your wide protection, give shelter for cattle and for steed.

Sanskit Text: पर कर्तान्य रजीषिणः कण्वा इन्द्रस्य गाथया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra kṛtāny ṛjīṣiṇaḥ kaṇvā indrasya ghāthayā |
Translation: 1. KANVAS, tell forth with song the deeds of Indra, the Impetuous,

Sanskit Text: मदे सोमस्य वोचत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: made somasya vocata ||
Translation: Wrought in the Soma's wild delight.

Sanskit Text: यः सर्बिन्दमनर्शनिं पिप्रुं दासमहीशुवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ sṛbindamanarśaniṃ pipruṃ dāsamahīśuvam |
Translation: 2 Strong God, he slew Anarsani, Srbinda, Pipru, and the fiend,

Sanskit Text: वधीदुग्रो रिणन्नपः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vadhīdughro riṇannapaḥ ||
Translation: Ahīśuva, and loosed the floods.

Sanskit Text: नयर्बुदस्य विष्टपं वर्ष्माणं बर्हतस्तिर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nyarbudasya viṣṭapaṃ varṣmāṇaṃ bṛhatastira |
Translation: 3. Thou broughtest down the dwelling-place, the height of lofty Arbuda.

Sanskit Text: कर्षे तदिन्द्र पौंस्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṣe tadindra pauṃsyam ||
Translation: That exploit, Indra, must be famed.

Sanskit Text: परति शरुताय वो धर्षत तूर्णाशं न गिरेरधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati śrutāya vo dhṛṣat tūrṇāśaṃ na ghireradhi |
Translation: 4 Bold, to your famous Soma I call the fair-visored God for aid,

Sanskit Text: हुवेसुशिप्रमूतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: huvesuśipramūtaye ||
Translation: Down like a torrent from the hill.

Sanskit Text: स गोरश्वस्य वि वरजं मन्दानः सोम्येभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ghoraśvasya vi vrajaṃ mandānaḥ somyebhyaḥ |
Translation: 5 Rejoicing in the Soma-draughts, Hero, burst open, like a fort,

Sanskit Text: पुरं नशूर दर्षसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: puraṃ naśūra darṣasi ||
Translation: The stall of horses and of kine.

Sanskit Text: यदि मे रारणः सुत उक्थे वा दधसे चनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadi me rāraṇaḥ suta ukthe vā dadhase canaḥ |
Translation: 6 If my libation gladdens, if thou takest pleasure in my laud,

Sanskit Text: आरादुपस्वधा गहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ārādupasvadhā ghahi ||
Translation: Come with thy Godhead from afar.

Sanskit Text: वयं घा ते अपि षमसि सतोतार इन्द्र गिर्वणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ ghā te api ṣmasi stotāra indra ghirvaṇaḥ |
Translation: 7 O Indra, Lover of the Song, the singers of thy praise are we:

Sanskit Text: तवं नो जिन्व सोमपाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ no jinva somapāḥ ||
Translation: O Soma-drinker, quicken us.

Sanskit Text: उत नः पितुमा भर संरराणो अविक्षितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta naḥ pitumā bhara saṃrarāṇo avikṣitam |
Translation: 8 And, taking thy delight with us bring us still undiminished food:

Sanskit Text: मघवन भूरि ते वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maghavan bhūri te vasu ||
Translation: Great is thy wealth, O Maghavan.

Sanskit Text: उत नो गोमतस कर्धि हिरण्यवतो अश्विनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta no ghomatas kṛdhi hiraṇyavato aśvinaḥ |
Translation: 9 Make thou us rich in herds of kine, in steeds, in gold: let us exert

Sanskit Text: इळाभिः सं रभेमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iḷābhiḥ saṃ rabhemahi ||
Translation: Our strength in sacrificial gifts.

Sanskit Text: बर्बदुक्थं हवामहे सर्प्रकरस्नमूतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛbadukthaṃ havāmahe sṛprakarasnamūtaye |
Translation: 10 Let us call him to aid whose hands stretch far, to whom high laud is due.

Sanskit Text: साधु कर्ण्वन्तमवसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sādhu kṛṇvantamavase ||
Translation: Who worketh well to succour us.

Sanskit Text: यः संस्थे चिच्छतक्रतुरादीं कर्णोति वर्त्रहा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ saṃsthe cicchatakraturādīṃ kṛṇoti vṛtrahā |
Translation: 11 He, Śatakratu, even in fight acts as a Vṛtra-slayer s,till:

Sanskit Text: जरित्र्भ्यः पुरूवसुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jaritṛbhyaḥ purūvasuḥ ||
Translation: He gives his worshippers much wealth.

Sanskit Text: स नः शक्रश्चिदा शकद दानवानन्तराभरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ śakraścidā śakad dānavānantarābharaḥ |
Translation: 12 May he, this A;akra, strengthen us, Boon God who satisfies our needs,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रोविश्वाभिरूतिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indroviśvābhirūtibhiḥ ||
Translation: Indra, with all lhis saving helps.

Sanskit Text: यो रायो.अवनिर्महान सुपारः सुन्वतः सखा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo rāyo.avanirmahān supāraḥ sunvataḥ sakhā |
Translation: 13 To him, the mighty stream of wealth, the Soma-presser's rescuing Friend,

Sanskit Text: तमिन्द्रमभि गायत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamindramabhi ghāyata ||
Translation: To Indra sing your song of praise;

Sanskit Text: आयन्तारं महि सथिरं पर्तनासु शरवोजितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āyantāraṃ mahi sthiraṃ pṛtanāsu śravojitam |
Translation: 14 Who bringeth what is great and firm, who winneth glory in his wars,

Sanskit Text: भूरेरीशानमोजसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūrerīśānamojasā ||
Translation: Lord of vast wealth through power and might.

Sanskit Text: नकिरस्य शचीनां नियन्ता सून्र्तानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nakirasya śacīnāṃ niyantā sūnṛtānām |
Translation: 15 There liveth none to cheek or stay his energies and gracious deeds:

Sanskit Text: नकिर्वक्ता नदादिति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nakirvaktā nadāditi ||
Translation: None who can say, He giveth not.

Sanskit Text: न नूनं बरह्मणां रणं पराशूनामस्ति सुन्वताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na nūnaṃ brahmaṇāṃ ṛṇaṃ prāśūnāmasti sunvatām |
Translation: 16 No debt is due by Brahmans now, by active men who press the juice:

Sanskit Text: न सोमो अप्रता पपे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na somo apratā pape ||
Translation: Well hath each Soma-draught been paid.

Sanskit Text: पन्य इदुप गायत पन्य उक्थानि शंसत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: panya idupa ghāyata panya ukthāni śaṃsata |
Translation: 17 Sing ye to him who must be praised, say lauds to him who must be praised,

Sanskit Text: बरह्मा कर्णोतपन्य इत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmā kṛṇotapanya it ||
Translation: Bring prayer to him who must be praised.

Sanskit Text: पन्य आ दर्दिरच्छता सहस्रा वाज्यव्र्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: panya ā dardiracchatā sahasrā vājyavṛtaḥ |
Translation: 18 May be, unchecked, strong, meet for praise, bring hundreds, thousands forth to light,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो यो यज्वनो वर्धः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro yo yajvano vṛdhaḥ ||
Translation: Indra who aids the worshipper.

Sanskit Text: वि षू चर सवधा अनु कर्ष्टीनामन्वाहुवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi ṣū cara svadhā anu kṛṣṭīnāmanvāhuvaḥ |
Translation: 19 Go with thy God-like nature forth, go where the folk are calling thee:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र पिब सुतानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra piba sutānām ||
Translation: Drink, Indra, of the drops we pour.

Sanskit Text: पिब सवधैनवानामुत यस्तुग्र्ये सचा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: piba svadhainavānāmuta yastughrye sacā |
Translation: 20 Drink milky draughts which are thine own, this too which was with Tugrya once,

Sanskit Text: उतायमिन्द्र यस्तव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utāyamindra yastava ||
Translation: This is it, Indra, that is thine.

Sanskit Text: अतीहि मन्युषाविणं सुषुवांसमुपारणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atīhi manyuṣāviṇaṃ suṣuvāṃsamupāraṇe |
Translation: 21 Pass him who psours libations out in angry mood or after sin:

Sanskit Text: इमं रातंसुतं पिब ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ rātaṃsutaṃ piba ||
Translation: Here drink the juice we offer thee.

Sanskit Text: इहि तिस्रः परावत इहि पञ्च जनानति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ihi tisraḥ parāvata ihi pañca janānati |
Translation: 22 Over the three great distances, past the Five Peoples go thy way,

Sanskit Text: धेना इन्द्रावचाकशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhenā indrāvacākaśat ||
Translation: O Indra, noticing our voice.

Sanskit Text: सूर्यो रश्मिं यथा सर्जा तवा यछन्तु मे गिरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūryo raśmiṃ yathā sṛjā tvā yachantu me ghiraḥ |
Translation: 23 Send forth thy ray like Sūrya: let my songs attract thee hitherward,

Sanskit Text: निम्नमापो न सध्र्यक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nimnamāpo na sadhryak ||
Translation: Like waters gathering to the vale.

Sanskit Text: अध्वर्यवा तु हि षिञ्च सोमं वीराय शिप्रिणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhvaryavā tu hi ṣiñca somaṃ vīrāya śipriṇe |
Translation: 24 Now to the Hero fair of cheek, Adhvaryu, pour the Soma forth:

Sanskit Text: भरासुतस्य पीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharāsutasya pītaye ||
Translation: Bring of the juice that he may drink

Sanskit Text: य उद्नः फलिगं भिनन नयक सिन्धून्रवास्र्जत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya udnaḥ phalighaṃ bhinan nyak sindhūnravāsṛjat |
Translation: 25 Who cleft the water-cloud in twain, loosed rivers for their downward flow,

Sanskit Text: यो गोषुपक्वं धारयत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo ghoṣupakvaṃ dhārayat ||
Translation: And set the ripe milk in the kine.

Sanskit Text: अहन वर्त्रं रचीषम और्णवाभमहीशुवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahan vṛtraṃ ṛcīṣama aurṇavābhamahīśuvam |
Translation: 26 He, meet for praise, slew Vṛtra, slew Ahīśuva, Urnavabha's son,

Sanskit Text: हिमेनाविध्यदर्बुदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: himenāvidhyadarbudam ||
Translation: And pierced th:rough Arbuda with frost.

Sanskit Text: पर व उग्राय निष्टुरे.अषाळ्हाय परसक्षिणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra va ughrāya niṣṭure.aṣāḷhāya prasakṣiṇe |
Translation: 27 To him your matchless Mighty One, unconquerable Conqueror,

Sanskit Text: देवत्तं बरह्म गायत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devattaṃ brahma ghāyata ||
Translation: Sing forth the prayer which Gods have given:

Sanskit Text: यो विश्वान्यभि वरता सोमस्य मदे अन्धसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo viśvānyabhi vratā somasya made andhasaḥ |
Translation: 28 Indra, who in the wild delight of Soma juice considers here

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो देवेषु चेतति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro deveṣu cetati ||
Translation: All holy Laws among the Gods.

Sanskit Text: इह तया सधमाद्या हरी हिरण्यकेश्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iha tyā sadhamādyā harī hiraṇyakeśyā |
Translation: 29 Hither let these thy Bays who share thy banquet, Steeds with golden manes,

Sanskit Text: वोळ्हामभि परयो हितम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: voḷhāmabhi prayo hitam ||
Translation: Convey thee to the feast prepared.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाञ्चं तवा पुरुष्टुत परियमेधस्तुता हरी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāñcaṃ tvā puruṣṭuta priyamedhastutā harī |
Translation: 30 Hither, O thou whom many laud, the Bays whom Priyamedha praised,

Sanskit Text: सोमपेयायवक्षतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somapeyāyavakṣataḥ ||
Translation: Shall bring thee to the Soma-draught.

Sanskit Text: वयं घ तवा सुतावन्त आपो न वर्क्तबर्हिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ gha tvā sutāvanta āpo na vṛktabarhiṣaḥ |
Translation: 1. WE compass thee like waters, we whose grass is trimmed and Soma pressed.

Sanskit Text: पवित्रस्यप्रस्रवणेषु वर्त्रहन परि सतोतार आसते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavitrasyaprasravaṇeṣu vṛtrahan pari stotāra āsate ||
Translation: Here where the filter pours its stream, thy worshippers round thee, O Vṛtra-slayer, sit.

Sanskit Text: सवरन्ति तवा सुते नरो वसो निरेक उक्थिनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svaranti tvā sute naro vaso nireka ukthinaḥ |
Translation: 2 Men, Vasu! by the Soma, with lauds call thee to the foremost place:

Sanskit Text: कदा सुतं तर्षाण ओक आ गम इन्द्र सवब्दीव वंसगः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadā sutaṃ tṛṣāṇa oka ā ghama indra svabdīva vaṃsaghaḥ ||
Translation: When comest thou athirst unto the juice as home, O Indra, like a bellowing bull?

Sanskit Text: कण्वेभिर्ध्र्ष्णवा धर्षद वाजं दर्षि सहस्रिणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaṇvebhirdhṛṣṇavā dhṛṣad vājaṃ darṣi sahasriṇam |
Translation: 3 Boldly, Bold Hero, bring us spoil in thousands for the Kaṇvas' sake.

Sanskit Text: पिशङगरूपं मघवन विचर्षणे मक्षू गोमन्तमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: piśaṅgharūpaṃ maghavan vicarṣaṇe makṣū ghomantamīmahe ||
Translation: O active Maghavan, with eager prayer we crave the yellow-hued with store ol kine.

Sanskit Text: पाहि गायान्धसो मद इन्द्राय मेध्यातिथे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāhi ghāyāndhaso mada indrāya medhyātithe |
Translation: 4 Medhyātithi, to Indra sing, drink of the juice to make thee glad.

Sanskit Text: यः सम्मिश्लोहर्योर्यः सुते सचा वज्री रथो हिरण्ययः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ sammiśloharyoryaḥ sute sacā vajrī ratho hiraṇyayaḥ ||
Translation: Close-knit to his Bay Steeds, bolt-armed, beside the juice is he: his chariot is of gold.

Sanskit Text: यः सुषव्यः सुदक्षिण इनो यः सुक्रतुर्ग्र्णे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ suṣavyaḥ sudakṣiṇa ino yaḥ sukraturghṛṇe |
Translation: 5 He Who is praised as strong of hand both right and left, most wise and hold:

Sanskit Text: य आकरः सहस्रा यः शतामघ इन्द्रो यः पूर्भिदारितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya ākaraḥ sahasrā yaḥ śatāmagha indro yaḥ pūrbhidāritaḥ ||
Translation: Indra who, rich in hundreds, gathers thousands up, honoured as breaker-down of forts.

Sanskit Text: यो धर्षितो यो.अव्र्तो यो अस्ति शमश्रुषु शरितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo dhṛṣito yo.avṛto yo asti śmaśruṣu śritaḥ |
Translation: 6 The bold of heart whom none provokes, who stands in bearded confidence;

Sanskit Text: विभूतद्युम्नश्च्यवनः पुरुष्टुतः करत्वा गौरिव शाकिनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vibhūtadyumnaścyavanaḥ puruṣṭutaḥ kratvā ghauriva śākinaḥ ||
Translation: Much-lauded, very glorious, overthrowing foes, strong Helper, like a bull with might.

Sanskit Text: क ईं वेद सुते सचा पिबन्तं कद वयो दधे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ka īṃ veda sute sacā pibantaṃ kad vayo dadhe |
Translation: 7 Who knows what vital ower he wins, drinking beside the flowing juice?

Sanskit Text: अयं यःपुरो विभिनत्त्योजसा मन्दानः शिप्र्यन्धसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ yaḥpuro vibhinattyojasā mandānaḥ śipryandhasaḥ ||
Translation: This is the fair-checked God who, joying in the draught, breaks down the castles in his strength.

Sanskit Text: दाना मर्गो न वारणः पुरुत्रा चरथं दधे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dānā mṛgho na vāraṇaḥ purutrā carathaṃ dadhe |
Translation: 8 As a wild elephant rushes on this way and that way, mad with heat,'

Sanskit Text: नकिष टवा नि यमदा सुते गमो महांश्चरस्योजसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nakiṣ ṭvā ni yamadā sute ghamo mahāṃścarasyojasā ||
Translation: None may compel thee, yet come hither to the draught: thou movest mighty in thy power.

Sanskit Text: य उग्रः सन्ननिष्ट्र्त सथिरो रणाय संस्क्र्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya ughraḥ sannaniṣṭṛta sthiro raṇāya saṃskṛtaḥ |
Translation: 9 When he, the Mighty, ne’er o’erthrown, steadfast, made ready for the fight,

Sanskit Text: यदि सतोतुर्मघवा शर्णवद धवं नेन्द्रो योषत्या गमत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadi stoturmaghavā śṛṇavad dhavaṃ nendro yoṣatyā ghamat ||
Translation: When Indra Maghavan lists to his praiser's call, he will not stand aloof, but come.

Sanskit Text: सत्यमित्था वर्षेदसि वर्षजूतिर्नो.अव्र्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satyamitthā vṛṣedasi vṛṣajūtirno.avṛtaḥ |
Translation: 10 Yea, verily, thou art a Bull, with a bull's rush. whom none may stay:

Sanskit Text: वर्षा हयुग्र शर्ण्विषे परावति वर्षो अर्वावति शरुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā hyughra śṛṇviṣe parāvati vṛṣo arvāvati śrutaḥ ||
Translation: Thou Mighty One, art celebrated as a Bull, famed as a Bull both near and far.

Sanskit Text: वर्षणस्ते अभीशवो वर्षा कशा हिरण्ययी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣaṇaste abhīśavo vṛṣā kaśā hiraṇyayī |
Translation: 11 Thy reins are very bulls in strength, bulls' strength is in thy golden whip.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा रथो मघवन वर्षणा हरी वर्षा तवं सतक्रतो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā ratho maghavan vṛṣaṇā harī vṛṣā tvaṃ satakrato ||
Translation: Thy car, O Maghavan, thy Bays are strong as bulls: thou, Śatakratu, art a Bull.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा सोता सुनोतु ते वर्षन्न्र्जीपिन्ना भर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā sotā sunotu te vṛṣannṛjīpinnā bhara |
Translation: 12 Let the strong presser press for thee. Bring hither, thou straight-rushing Bull.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा दधन्वे वर्षणं नदीष्वा तुभ्यं सथातर्हरीणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā dadhanve vṛṣaṇaṃ nadīṣvā tubhyaṃ sthātarharīṇām ||
Translation: The mighty makes the mighty run in flowing streams for thee whom thy Bay Horses bear.

Sanskit Text: एन्द्र याहि पीतये मधु शविष्ठ सोम्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: endra yāhi pītaye madhu śaviṣṭha somyam |
Translation: 13 Come, thou most potent Indra, come to drink the savoury Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: नायमछा मघवा शर्णवद गिरो बरह्मोक्था च सुक्रतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāyamachā maghavā śṛṇavad ghiro brahmokthā ca sukratuḥ ||
Translation: Maghavan, very wise, will quickly come to hear the songs, the prayer, the hymns of praise.

Sanskit Text: वहन्तु तवा रथेष्ठामा हरयो रथयुजः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vahantu tvā ratheṣṭhāmā harayo rathayujaḥ |
Translation: 14 When thou hast mounted on thy car let thy yoked Bay Steeds carry thee,

Sanskit Text: तिरश्चिदर्यं सवनानि वर्त्रहन्नन्येषां या शतक्रतो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tiraścidaryaṃ savanāni vṛtrahannanyeṣāṃ yā śatakrato ||
Translation: Past other men's libations, Lord of Hundred Powers, thee, Vṛtra-slayer, thee our Friend.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकमद्यान्तमं सतोमं धिष्व महामह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākamadyāntamaṃ stomaṃ dhiṣva mahāmaha |
Translation: 15 O thou Most Lofty One, accept our laud as nearest to thine heart.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकं ते सवना सन्तु शन्तमा मदाय दयुक्ष सोमपाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākaṃ te savanā santu śantamā madāya dyukṣa somapāḥ ||
Translation: May our libations be most sweet to make thee glad, O Soma-drinker, Heavenly Lord.

Sanskit Text: नहि षस्तव नो मम शास्त्रे अन्यस्य रण्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi ṣastava no mama śāstre anyasya raṇyati |
Translation: 16 Neither in thy decree nor mine, but in another's he delights,—

Sanskit Text: यो अस्मान्वीर आनयत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo asmānvīra ānayat ||
Translation: The man who brought us unto this.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रश्चिद घा तदब्रवीत सत्रिया अशास्यं मनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraścid ghā tadabravīt striyā aśāsyaṃ manaḥ |
Translation: 17 Indra himself hath said, The mind of woman brooks not discipline,

Sanskit Text: उतो अह करतुं रघुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto aha kratuṃ raghum ||
Translation: Her intellect hath little weight.

Sanskit Text: सप्ती चिद घा मदच्युता मिथुना वहतो रथम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saptī cid ghā madacyutā mithunā vahato ratham |
Translation: 18 His pair of horses, rushing on in their wild transport, draw his car:

Sanskit Text: एवेद धूर्व्र्ष्ण उत्तरा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eved dhūrvṛṣṇa uttarā ||
Translation: High-lifted is the stallion's yoke.

Sanskit Text: अधः पश्यस्व मोपरि सन्तरां पादकौ हर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhaḥ paśyasva mopari santarāṃ pādakau hara |
Translation: 19 Cast down thine eyes and look not up. More closely set thy feet. Let none

Sanskit Text: मा ते कषप्लकौ दर्शन सत्री हि बरह्मा बभूविथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā te kaṣaplakau dṛśan strī hi brahmā babhūvitha ||
Translation: See what thy garment veils, for thou, a Brahman, hast become a dame.

Sanskit Text: अग्निनेन्द्रेण वरुणेन विष्णुनादित्यै रुद्रैर्वसुभिः सचाभुवा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghninendreṇa varuṇena viṣṇunādityai rudrairvasubhiḥ sacābhuvā |
Translation: 1. WITH Agni and with Indra, Viṣṇu. Varuṇa, with the Ādityas, Rudras, Vasus, closely leagued;

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण च सोमं पिबतमश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somaṃ pibatamaśvinā ||
