Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, drink the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: विश्वाभिर्धीभिर्भुवनेन वाजिना दिवा पर्थिव्याद्रिभिः सचाभुवा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvābhirdhībhirbhuvanena vājinā divā pṛthivyādribhiḥ sacābhuvā |
Translation: 2 With all the Holy Thoughts, all being Mighty Ones! in close alliance wil the Mountains, Heaven, and Earth;

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā ... ||
Translation: Accordant. of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, drink the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: विश्वैर्देवैस्त्रिभिरेकादशैरिहाद्भिर्मरुद्भिर्भ्र्गुभिः सचाभुवा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvairdevaistribhirekādaśairihādbhirmarudbhirbhṛghubhiḥ sacābhuvā |
Translation: 3 With all the Deities, three times eleven, here, in close alliance with the Maruts, Bhṛgus, Floods;

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā ... ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, drink the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: जुषेथां यज्ञं बोधतं हवस्य मे विश्वेह देवौ सवनाव गछतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣethāṃ yajñaṃ bodhataṃ havasya me viśveha devau savanāva ghachatam |
Translation: 4 Accept the sacrifice, attend to this my call: come nigh, O ye Twain Gods, to all libations here.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चेषं नो वोळ्हमश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ceṣaṃ no voḷhamaśvinā ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, bring us strengthening food.

Sanskit Text: सतोमं जुषेथां युवशेव कन्यनां विश्वेह देवौ सवनाव गछतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stomaṃ juṣethāṃ yuvaśeva kanyanāṃ viśveha devau savanāva ghachatam |
Translation: 5 Accept our praise-song as a youth accepts a maid. Come nigh, O ye Twain Gods, to all libations here.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येन चेषं ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryena ceṣaṃ ... ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, bring us strengthening food.

Sanskit Text: गिरो जुषेथामध्वरं जुषेथां विश्वेह देवौ सवनाव गछतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghiro juṣethāmadhvaraṃ juṣethāṃ viśveha devau savanāva ghachatam |
Translation: 6 Accept the songs we sing, accept the solemn rite. Come nigh, O ye Twain Gods, to all libations here.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चेषं ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ceṣaṃ ... ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, bring us strengthening food.

Sanskit Text: हारिद्रवेव पतथो वनेदुप सोमं सुतं महिषेवाव गछथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hāridraveva patatho vanedupa somaṃ sutaṃ mahiṣevāva ghachathaḥ |
Translation: 7 Ye fly as starlings fly unto the forest trees; like buffaloes ye seek the Soma we have shed.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण च तरिर्वर्तिर्यातमश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca trirvartiryātamaśvinā ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, come thrice, O Aśvins, to our home.

Sanskit Text: हंसाविव पतथो अध्वगाविव सोमं सुतं महिषेवाव गछथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: haṃsāviva patatho adhvaghāviva somaṃ sutaṃ mahiṣevāva ghachathaḥ |
Translation: 8 Ye fly like swans, like those who travel on their way; like buffaloes ye seek the Soma we have shed.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण च तरिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca trir... ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, come thrice, O Aśvins, to our home.

Sanskit Text: शयेनाविव पतथो हव्यदातये सोमं सुतं महिषेवाव गछथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śyenāviva patatho havyadātaye somaṃ sutaṃ mahiṣevāva ghachathaḥ |
Translation: 9 Ye fly to our oblation like a pair of hawks; like buffaloes ye seek the Soma we have shed.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण च तरिर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca trir... ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, come thrice, O Aśvins, to our home.

Sanskit Text: पिबतं च तर्प्णुतं चा च गछतं परजां च धत्तं दरविणं च धत्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibataṃ ca tṛpṇutaṃ cā ca ghachataṃ prajāṃ ca dhattaṃ draviṇaṃ ca dhattam |
Translation: 10 Come hitherward and drink and satisfy yourselves, bestow upon us progeny and affluence.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चोर्जं नो धत्तमश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa corjaṃ no dhattamaśvinā ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, grant us vigorous strength.

Sanskit Text: जयतं च पर सतुतं च पर चावतं परजां च धत्तं दरविणं च धत्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jayataṃ ca pra stutaṃ ca pra cāvataṃ prajāṃ ca dhattaṃ draviṇaṃ ca dhattam |
Translation: 11 Conquer your foes, protect us, praise your worshippers; bestow upon us progeny and affluence.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चोर्जं ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa corjaṃ ... ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, grant us vigorous strength.

Sanskit Text: हतं च शत्रून यततं च मित्रिणः परजां च धत्तं दरविणं च धत्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hataṃ ca śatrūn yatataṃ ca mitriṇaḥ prajāṃ ca dhattaṃ draviṇaṃ ca dhattam |
Translation: 12 Slay enemies, animate men whom ye befriend; bestow upon us progeny and affluence.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चोर्जं ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa corjaṃ ... ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, grant us vigorous strength.

Sanskit Text: मित्रावरुणवन्ता उत धर्मवन्ता मरुत्वन्ता जरितुर्गछथो हवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitrāvaruṇavantā uta dharmavantā marutvantā jariturghachatho havam |
Translation: 13 With Mitra, Varuṇa, Dharma, and the Maruts in your company approach unto your praiser's call.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चादित्यैर्यातमश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa cādityairyātamaśvinā ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, and with the Ādityas, Aśvins! come.

Sanskit Text: अङगिरस्वन्ता उत विष्णुवन्ता मरुत्वन्ता जरितुर्गछथो हवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṅghirasvantā uta viṣṇuvantā marutvantā jariturghachatho havam |
Translation: 14 With Viṣṇu and the Aṅgirases attending you, and with the Maruts come unto your praiser's call.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चादित्यैर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa cādityair... ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, and with the Ādityas, Aśvins! come.

Sanskit Text: रभुमन्ता वर्षणा वाजवन्ता मरुत्वन्ता जरितुर्गछथो हवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛbhumantā vṛṣaṇā vājavantā marutvantā jariturghachatho havam |
Translation: 15 With Ṛbhus and With Vājas. O ye Mighty Ones, leagued with the Maruts come ye to your praiser's call.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चादित्यैर... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa cādityair... ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, and with the Ādityas, Aśvins! come.

Sanskit Text: बरह्म जिन्वतमुत जिन्वतं धियो हतं रक्षांसि सेधतममीवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahma jinvatamuta jinvataṃ dhiyo hataṃ rakṣāṃsi sedhatamamīvāḥ |
Translation: 16 Give spirit to our prayer and animate our thoughts; slay ye the Rākṣasas and drive away disease.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण च सोमं सुन्वतो अश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somaṃ sunvato aśvinā ||
Translation: Accordant, of One mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, -the presser's Soma, Aśvins drink.

Sanskit Text: कषत्रं जिन्वतमुत जिन्वतं नॄन हतं रक्षाण्सि सेधतममीवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣatraṃ jinvatamuta jinvataṃ nṝn hataṃ rakṣāṇsi sedhatamamīvāḥ |
Translation: 17 Strengthen the Ruling Power, strengthen the men of war; slay ye the Rākṣasas and drive away disease.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण च सोमं ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somaṃ ... ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, the presser's Soma, Aśvins drink.

Sanskit Text: धेनूर्जिन्वतमुत जिन्वतं विशो हतं रक्षांसि सेधतममीवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhenūrjinvatamuta jinvataṃ viśo hataṃ rakṣāṃsi sedhatamamīvāḥ |
Translation: 18 Give strength unto the milch-kine, give the people strength, slay ye the Rākṣasas and drive away disease.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण च सोमं ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somaṃ ... ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, the presser's Soma, Aśvins drink.

Sanskit Text: अत्रेरिव शर्णुतं पूर्व्यस्तुतिं शयावाश्वस्य सुन्वतो मदच्युता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atreriva śṛṇutaṃ pūrvyastutiṃ śyāvāśvasya sunvato madacyutā |
Translation: 19 As ye heard Atri's earliest eulogy, so hear Śyāvāśva, Soma-presser, ye who reel in joy.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येन चाश्विना तिरोह्न्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryena cāśvinā tiroahnyam ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, drink juice, O Aśvins, three days old.

Sanskit Text: सर्गानिव सर्जतं सुष्टुतीरुप शयावाश्वस्य सुन्वतो मदच्युता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarghāniva sṛjataṃ suṣṭutīrupa śyāvāśvasya sunvato madacyutā |
Translation: 20 Further like running streams Śyāvāśva's eulogies who presses out the Soma, ye who reel in joy.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चाश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa cāśvinā ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, drink juice, O Aśvins, three days old.

Sanskit Text: रश्मीन्रिव यछतमध्वरानुप शयावाश्वस्य सुन्वतो मदच्युता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: raśmīnriva yachatamadhvarānupa śyāvāśvasya sunvato madacyutā |
Translation: 21 Seize, as ye grasp the reins, Śyāvāśva's solemn rites who presses out the Soma, ye who reel in joy.

Sanskit Text: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चाश्विना ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa cāśvinā ... ||
Translation: Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, drink juice, O Aśvins, three days old.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाग रथं नि यछतं पिबतं सोम्यं मधु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāgh rathaṃ ni yachataṃ pibataṃ somyaṃ madhu |
Translation: 22 Drive down your chariot hitherward drink ye the Soma's savoury juice.

Sanskit Text: आ यातमश्विना गतमवस्युर्वामहं हुवे धत्तं रत्नानि दाशुषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yātamaśvinā ghatamavasyurvāmahaṃ huve dhattaṃ ratnāni dāśuṣe ||
Translation: Approach, ye Aśvins, come to us: I call you, eager for your aid. Grant treasures to the worshipper.

Sanskit Text: नमोवाके परस्थिते अध्वरे नरा विवक्षणस्य पीतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: namovāke prasthite adhvare narā vivakṣaṇasya pītaye |
Translation: 23 When sacrifice which tells our reverence hath begun. Heroes! to drink the gushing juice,

Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yātaṃ ... ||
Translation: Approach, ye Aśvins, come to us: I call you, eager for your aid. Grant treasures to the worshipper.

Sanskit Text: सवाहाक्र्तस्य तर्म्पतं सुतस्य देवावन्धसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāhākṛtasya tṛmpataṃ sutasya devāvandhasaḥ |
Translation: 24 Sate you with consecrated drink, with juice effused, ye Deities.

Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yātaṃ ... ||
Translation: Approach, ye Aśvins, come to us: I call you, eager for your aid. Grant treasures to the worshipper.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञस्य हि सथ रत्विजा सस्नी वाजेषु कर्मसु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñasya hi stha ṛtvijā sasnī vājeṣu karmasu |
Translation: 1. YE Twain are Priests of sacrifice, winners in war and holy works:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नीतस्य बोधतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnītasya bodhatam ||
Translation: Indra and Agni, mark this well.

Sanskit Text: तोशासा रथयावाना वर्त्रहणापराजिता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tośāsā rathayāvānā vṛtrahaṇāparājitā |
Translation: 2 Ye bounteous riders on the car, ye Vṛtra-slayers unsubdued:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी तस्य बोधतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī tasya bodhatam ||
Translation: Indra and Agni, mark this well.

Sanskit Text: इदं वां मदिरं मध्वधुक्षन्नद्रिभिर्नरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ vāṃ madiraṃ madhvadhukṣannadribhirnaraḥ |
Translation: 3 The men with pressing-stones have pressed this meath of yours which gives delight:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी तस्य बोधतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī tasya bodhatam ||
Translation: Indra, and Agni, mark this well.

Sanskit Text: जुषेथां यज्ञमिष्टये सुतं सोमं सधस्तुती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣethāṃ yajñamiṣṭaye sutaṃ somaṃ sadhastutī |
Translation: 4 Accept our sacrifice for weal, sharers of praise! the Soma shed:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी आ गतं नरा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī ā ghataṃ narā ||
Translation: Indra and Agni, Heroes, come.

Sanskit Text: इमा जुषेथां सवना येभिर्हव्यान्यूहथुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā juṣethāṃ savanā yebhirhavyānyūhathuḥ |
Translation: 5 Be pleased with these libations which attract you to our sacred gifts

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नीा गतं नरा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnīā ghataṃ narā ||
Translation: Indra and Agni, Heroes, come.

Sanskit Text: इमां गायत्रवर्तनिं जुषेथां सुष्टुतिं मम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imāṃ ghāyatravartaniṃ juṣethāṃ suṣṭutiṃ mama |
Translation: 6 Accept this eulogy of mine whose model is the Gāyatrī:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी आ गतं नरा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī ā ghataṃ narā ||
Translation: Indra and Agni, Heroes, Come.

Sanskit Text: परातर्यावभिरा गतं देवेभिर्जेन्यावसू |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātaryāvabhirā ghataṃ devebhirjenyāvasū |
Translation: 7 Come with the early-faring Gods, ye who are Lords of genuine wealth:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी सोमपीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī somapītaye ||
Translation: Indra-Agni, to the Soma-draught

Sanskit Text: शयावाश्वस्य सुन्वतो.अत्रीणां शर्णुतं हवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śyāvāśvasya sunvato.atrīṇāṃ śṛṇutaṃ havam |
Translation: 8 Hear ye the call of Atris, hear Śyāvāśva as he sheds the juice:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नीसोमपीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnīsomapītaye ||
Translation: Indra-Agni to the Soma-draught

Sanskit Text: एवा वामह्व ऊतये यथाहुवन्त मेधिराः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā vāmahva ūtaye yathāhuvanta medhirāḥ |
Translation: 9 Thus have I called you to our aid as sages called on you of old:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रग्नी सोमपीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraghnī somapītaye ||
Translation: Indra-Agni to the Soma draught!

Sanskit Text: आहं सरस्वतीवतोरिन्द्राग्न्योरवो वर्णे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āhaṃ sarasvatīvatorindrāghnyoravo vṛṇe |
Translation: 10 Indra's and Agni's grace I claim, Sarasvatī's associates

Sanskit Text: याभ्यां गायत्रं रच्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhyāṃ ghāyatraṃ ṛcyate ||
Translation: To whom this psalm of praise is sung.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी युवं सु नः सहन्ता दासथो रयिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī yuvaṃ su naḥ sahantā dāsatho rayim |
Translation: 1. INDRA and Agni, surely ye as Conquerors will give us wealth,

Sanskit Text: येन दर्ळ्हा समत्स्वा वीळु चित साहिषीमह्यग्निर्वनेव वात इन नभन्तामन्यके समे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena dṛḷhā samatsvā vīḷu cit sāhiṣīmahyaghnirvaneva vāta in nabhantāmanyake same ||
Translation: Whereby in fight we may o’ercome that which is strong and firmly fixed, as Agni burns the woods with wind. Let all the others die away.

Sanskit Text: नहि वां वव्रयामहे.अथेन्द्रमिद यजामहे शविष्ठं नर्णां नरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi vāṃ vavrayāmahe.athendramid yajāmahe śaviṣṭhaṃ nṛṇāṃ naram |
Translation: 2 We set no snares to tangle you; Indra we worship and adore, Hero of heroes mightiest.

Sanskit Text: स नः कदा चिदर्वता गमदा वाजसातयेगमदा मेधसातये नभन्तामन्यके समे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ kadā cidarvatā ghamadā vājasātayeghamadā medhasātaye nabhantāmanyake same ||
Translation: Once may he come unto us with his Steed, come unto us to win us strength, and to complete the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: ता हि मध्यं भराणामिन्द्राग्नी अधिक्षितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā hi madhyaṃ bharāṇāmindrāghnī adhikṣitaḥ |
Translation: 3 For, famous Indra-Agni, ye are dwellers in the midst of frays.

Sanskit Text: ता उ कवित्वना कवी पर्छ्यमाना सखीयते सं धीतमश्नुतं नरा नभन्तामन्यके समे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā u kavitvanā kavī pṛchyamānā sakhīyate saṃ dhītamaśnutaṃ narā nabhantāmanyake same ||
Translation: Sages in wisdom, ye are knit to him who seeketh you as friends. Heroes, bestow on him his wish.

Sanskit Text: अभ्यर्च नभाकवदिन्द्राग्नी यजसा गिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhyarca nabhākavadindrāghnī yajasā ghirā |
Translation: 4 Nabhāka-like, with sacred song Indra's and Agni's praise I sing,

Sanskit Text: ययोर्विश्वमिदं जगदियं दयौः पर्थिवी मह्युपस्थे बिभ्र्तो वसु नभन्तामन्यके समे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayorviśvamidaṃ jaghadiyaṃ dyauḥ pṛthivī mahyupasthe bibhṛto vasu nabhantāmanyake same ||
Translation: Theirs to whom all this world belongs, this heaven and this mighty earth which bear rich treasure in their lap.

Sanskit Text: पर बरह्माणि नभाकवदिन्द्राग्निभ्यामिरज्यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra brahmāṇi nabhākavadindrāghnibhyāmirajyata |
Translation: 5 To Indra and to Agni send your prayers, as was Nabhāka's wont,—

Sanskit Text: या सप्तबुध्नमर्णवं जिह्मबारमपोर्णुत इन्द्र ईशान ओजसा नभन्तामन्यके समे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā saptabudhnamarṇavaṃ jihmabāramaporṇuta indra īśāna ojasā nabhantāmanyake same ||
Translation: Who oped with sideway opening the sea with its foundations seven—Indra all powerful in his might.

Sanskit Text: अपि वर्श्च पुराणवद वरततेरिव गुष्पितमोजो दासस्य दम्भय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: api vṛśca purāṇavad vratateriva ghuṣpitamojo dāsasya dambhaya |
Translation: 6 Tear thou asunder, as of old, like tangles of a creeping plant,

Sanskit Text: वयं तदस्य सम्भ्र्तं वस्विन्द्रेण वि भजेमहि नभन्तामन्यके समे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ tadasya sambhṛtaṃ vasvindreṇa vi bhajemahi nabhantāmanyake same ||
Translation: Demolish thou the Dāsa's might. May we with Indra's help divide the treasure he hath gathered up.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्राग्नी जना इमे विह्वयन्ते तना गिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindrāghnī janā ime vihvayante tanā ghirā |
Translation: 7 What time with this same song these men call Indra-Agni sundry ways,

Sanskit Text: अस्माकेभिर्न्र्भिर्वयं सासह्याम पर्तन्यतो वनुयाम वनुष्यतो नभन्तामन्यके समे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākebhirnṛbhirvayaṃ sāsahyāma pṛtanyato vanuyāma vanuṣyato nabhantāmanyake same ||
Translation: May we with our own heroes quell those who provoke us to the fight, and conquer those who strive with us.

Sanskit Text: या नु शवेताववो दिव उच्चरात उप दयुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā nu śvetāvavo diva uccarāta upa dyubhiḥ |
Translation: 8 The Two refulgent with their beams rise and come downward from the sky.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्न्योरनु वरतमुहाना यन्ति सिन्धवो यान सीं बन्धादमुञ्चतां नभन्तामन्यके समे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnyoranu vratamuhānā yanti sindhavo yān sīṃ bandhādamuñcatāṃ nabhantāmanyake same ||
Translation: By Indra's and by Agni's hest, flowing away, the rivers, run which they released from their restraint.

Sanskit Text: पूर्वीष ट इन्द्रोपमातयः पूर्वीरुत परशस्तयः सूनोहिन्वस्य हरिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvīṣ ṭa indropamātayaḥ pūrvīruta praśastayaḥ sūnohinvasya harivaḥ |
Translation: 9 O Indra, many are thine aids, many thy ways of guiding us,

Sanskit Text: वस्वो वीरस्याप्र्चो या नु साधन्त नो धियो नभन्तामन्यके समे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasvo vīrasyāpṛco yā nu sādhanta no dhiyo nabhantāmanyake same ||
Translation: Lord of the Bay Steeds, Hinva's Son. To a Good Hero come our prayers, which soon shall have accomplishment.

Sanskit Text: तं शिशीता सुव्र्क्तिभिस्त्वेषं सत्वानं रग्मियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ śiśītā suvṛktibhistveṣaṃ satvānaṃ ṛghmiyam |
Translation: 10 Inspire him with your holy hymns, the Hero bright and glorious,

Sanskit Text: उतो नुचिद य ओजसा शुष्णस्याण्डानि भेदति जेषत सवर्वतीरपो नभन्तामन्यके समे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto nucid ya ojasā śuṣṇasyāṇḍāni bhedati jeṣat svarvatīrapo nabhantāmanyake same ||
Translation: Him who with might demolisheth even the brood of Śuṣṇa, and winneth for us the heavenly streams.

Sanskit Text: तं शिशीता सवध्वरं सत्यं सत्वानं रत्वियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ śiśītā svadhvaraṃ satyaṃ satvānaṃ ṛtviyam |
Translation: 11 Inspire him worshipped with fair rites, the glorious Hero truly brave.

Sanskit Text: उतो नुचिद य ओहत आण्डा शुष्णस्य भेदत्यजैः सवर्वतीरपो नभन्तामन्यके समे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto nucid ya ohata āṇḍā śuṣṇasya bhedatyajaiḥ svarvatīrapo nabhantāmanyake same ||
Translation: He brake in pieces Śuṣṇa's brood who still expected not the stroke, and won for us the heavenly streams. Let all the others die away.

Sanskit Text: एवेन्द्राग्निभ्यां पित्र्वन नवीयो मन्धात्र्वदङगिरस्वदवाचि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evendrāghnibhyāṃ pitṛvan navīyo mandhātṛvadaṅghirasvadavāci |
Translation: 12 Thus have we sung anew to Indra-Agni, as sang our sires, Aṅgirases, and Mandhātar.

Sanskit Text: तरिधातुना शर्मणा पातमस्मान वयं सयाम पतयो रयीणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tridhātunā śarmaṇā pātamasmān vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām ||
Translation: Guard us with triple shelter and preserve us: may we be masters of a store of riches.

Sanskit Text: अस्तभ्नाद दयामसुरो विश्ववेदा अमिमीत वरिमाणं पर्थिव्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: astabhnād dyāmasuro viśvavedā amimīta varimāṇaṃ pṛthivyāḥ |
Translation: 1. LORD of all wealth, the Asura propped the heavens, and measured out the broad earth's wide expanses.

Sanskit Text: आसीदद विश्वा भुवनानि सम्राड विश्वेत तानि वरुणस्य वरतानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsīdad viśvā bhuvanāni samrāḍ viśvet tāni varuṇasya vratāni ||
Translation: He, King supreme, approached all living creatures. All these are Varuṇa's holy operations.

Sanskit Text: एवा वन्दस्व वरुणं बर्हन्तं नमस्या धीरमम्र्तस्य गोपाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā vandasva varuṇaṃ bṛhantaṃ namasyā dhīramamṛtasya ghopām |
Translation: 2 So humbly worship Varuṇa the Mighty revere the wise Guard of World Immortal.

Sanskit Text: स नः शर्म तरिवरूथं वि यंसत पातं नो दयावाप्र्थिवी उपस्थे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ śarma trivarūthaṃ vi yaṃsat pātaṃ no dyāvāpṛthivī upasthe ||
Translation: May he vouchsafe us triply-barred protection. O Earth and Heaven, within your lap preserve us.

Sanskit Text: इमां धियं शिक्षमाणस्य देव करतुं दक्षं वरुण सं शिशाधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imāṃ dhiyaṃ śikṣamāṇasya deva kratuṃ dakṣaṃ varuṇa saṃ śiśādhi |
Translation: 3 Sharpen this song of him who strives his utmost, sharpen, God Varuṇa, his strength and insight;

Sanskit Text: ययाति विश्वा दुरिता तरेम सुतर्माणमधि नावं रुहेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayāti viśvā duritā tarema sutarmāṇamadhi nāvaṃ ruhema ||
Translation: May we ascend the ship that bears us safely, whereby we may pass over all misfortune.

Sanskit Text: आ वां गरावाणो अश्विना धीभिर्विप्रा अचुच्यवुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ ghrāvāṇo aśvinā dhībhirviprā acucyavuḥ |
Translation: 4 Aśvins, with songs the singer stones have made you hasten hitherward,

Sanskit Text: नासत्या सोमपीतये नभन्तामन्यके समे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāsatyā somapītaye nabhantāmanyake same ||
Translation: Nāsatyas, to the Soma-draught. Let all the others die away.

Sanskit Text: यथा वामत्रिरश्विना गीर्भिर्विप्रो अजोहवीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā vāmatriraśvinā ghīrbhirvipro ajohavīt |
Translation: 5 As the sage Atri with his hymns, O Aśvins, called you eagerly,

Sanskit Text: नासत्यासोमपीतये नभन्तामन्यके समे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāsatyāsomapītaye nabhantāmanyake same ||
Translation: Nāsatyas, to the Soma-draught. Let all the others die away.

Sanskit Text: एवा वामह्व ऊतये यथाहुवन्त मेधिराः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā vāmahva ūtaye yathāhuvanta medhirāḥ |
Translation: 6 So have I called you to our aid, even as the wise have called of old,

Sanskit Text: नासत्या सोमपीतये नभन्तामन्यके समे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāsatyā somapītaye nabhantāmanyake same ||
Translation: Nāsatyas, to the Soma-draught. Let all the others die away.

Sanskit Text: इमे विप्रस्य वेधसो.अग्नेरस्त्र्तयज्वनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime viprasya vedhaso.aghnerastṛtayajvanaḥ |
Translation: 1. THESE songs of mine go forth as lauds of Agni, the disposing Sage,

Sanskit Text: गिरः सतोमास ईरते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghiraḥ stomāsa īrate ||
Translation: Whose worshipper is ne’er o’erthrown.

Sanskit Text: अस्मै ते परतिहर्यते जातवेदो विचर्षणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmai te pratiharyate jātavedo vicarṣaṇe |
Translation: 2 Wise Agni Jātavedas, I beget a song of praise for thee.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने जनामि सुष्टुतिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne janāmi suṣṭutim ||
Translation: Who willingly receivest it.

Sanskit Text: आरोका इव घेदह तिग्मा अग्ने तव तविषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ārokā iva ghedaha tighmā aghne tava tviṣaḥ |
Translation: 3 Thy sharpened flames, O Agni, like the gleams of light that glitter through,

Sanskit Text: दद्भिर्वनानि बप्सति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadbhirvanāni bapsati ||
Translation: Devour the forests with their teeth.

Sanskit Text: हरयो धूमकेतवो वातजूता उप दयवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: harayo dhūmaketavo vātajūtā upa dyavi |
Translation: 4 Gold-coloured, bannered with the smoke, urged by the wind, aloft to heaven

Sanskit Text: यतन्ते वर्थगग्नयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatante vṛthaghaghnayaḥ ||
Translation: Rise, lightly borne, the flames of fire.

Sanskit Text: एते तये वर्थगग्नय इद्धासः समद्र्क्षत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete tye vṛthaghaghnaya iddhāsaḥ samadṛkṣata |
Translation: 5 These lightly kindled fiery flames are all around made visible,

Sanskit Text: उषसामिव केतवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣasāmiva ketavaḥ ||
Translation: Even as the gleanings of the Dawns.

Sanskit Text: कर्ष्णा रजांसि पत्सुतः परयाणे जातवेदसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṣṇā rajāṃsi patsutaḥ prayāṇe jātavedasaḥ |
Translation: 6 As Jātavedas speeds along, the dust is black beneath his feet,

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्यद रोधति कषमि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniryad rodhati kṣami ||
Translation: When Agni spreads upon the earth.

Sanskit Text: धासिं कर्ण्वान ओषधीर्बप्सदग्निर्न वायति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhāsiṃ kṛṇvāna oṣadhīrbapsadaghnirna vāyati |
Translation: 7 Making the plants his nourishment, Agni devours and wearies not,

Sanskit Text: पुनर्यन तरुणीरपि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punaryan taruṇīrapi ||
Translation: Seeking the tender shrubs again.

Sanskit Text: जिह्वाभिरह नन्नमदर्चिषा जञ्जणाभवन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jihvābhiraha nannamadarciṣā jañjaṇābhavan |
Translation: 8 Bending him down with all his tongues, he flickers with his fiery glow

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्वनेषु रोचते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirvaneṣu rocate ||
Translation: Splendid is Agni in the woods.

Sanskit Text: अप्स्वग्ने सधिष टव सौशधीरनु रुध्यसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apsvaghne sadhiṣ ṭava sauśadhīranu rudhyase |
Translation: 9 Agni, thine home is in the floods: into the plants thou forcest way,

Sanskit Text: गर्भे सञ्जायसे पुनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: gharbhe sañjāyase punaḥ ||
Translation: And as their Child art born anew.

Sanskit Text: उदग्ने तव तद घर्तादर्ची रोचत आहुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udaghne tava tad ghṛtādarcī rocata āhutam |
Translation: 10 Worshipped with offerings shines thy flame, O Agni, from the sacred oil,

Sanskit Text: निंसानं जुह्वो मुखे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niṃsānaṃ juhvo mukhe ||
Translation: With kisses on the ladle's mouth.

Sanskit Text: उक्षान्नाय वशान्नाय सोमप्र्ष्ठाय वेधसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukṣānnāya vaśānnāya somapṛṣṭhāya vedhase |
Translation: 11 Let us serve Agni with our hymns, Disposer, fed on ox and cow,

Sanskit Text: सतोमैर्विधेमाग्नये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stomairvidhemāghnaye ||
Translation: Who bears the Soma on his back.

Sanskit Text: उत तवा नमसा वयं होतर्वरेण्यक्रतो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tvā namasā vayaṃ hotarvareṇyakrato |
Translation: 12 Yea, thee, O Agni, do we seek with homage and with fuel, Priest

Sanskit Text: अग्ने समिद्भिरीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne samidbhirīmahe ||
Translation: Whose wisdom is most excellent.

Sanskit Text: उत तवा भर्गुवच्छुचे मनुष्वदग्न आहुत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tvā bhṛghuvacchuce manuṣvadaghna āhuta |
Translation: 13 O worshipped with oblations, pure Agni, we call on thee as erst,

Sanskit Text: अङगिरस्वद धवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṅghirasvad dhavāmahe ||
Translation: Did Bhṛgu, Manus, Aṅgiras.

Sanskit Text: तवं हयग्ने अग्निना विप्रो विप्रेण सन सता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hyaghne aghninā vipro vipreṇa san satā |
Translation: 14 For thou, O Agni, by the fire, Sage by the Sage, Good by the Good,

Sanskit Text: सखा सख्या समिध्यसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhā sakhyā samidhyase ||
Translation: Friend by the Friend, art lighted up.

Sanskit Text: स तवं विप्राय दाशुषे रयिं देहि सहस्रिणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvaṃ viprāya dāśuṣe rayiṃ dehi sahasriṇam |
Translation: 15 So wealth in thousands, food with store of heroes give thou to the sage,

Sanskit Text: अग्ने वीरवतीमिषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne vīravatīmiṣam ||
Translation: O Agni, to the worshipper.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने भरातः सहस्क्र्त रोहिदश्व शुचिव्रत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne bhrātaḥ sahaskṛta rohidaśva śucivrata |
Translation: 16 O Agni, Brother, made by strength, Lord of red steeds and brilliant sway,

Sanskit Text: इमं सतोमंजुषस्व मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ stomaṃjuṣasva me ||
Translation: Take pleasure in this laud of mine.

Sanskit Text: उत तवाग्ने मम सतुतो वाश्राय परतिहर्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tvāghne mama stuto vāśrāya pratiharyate |
Translation: 17 My praises, Agni, go to thee, as the cows seek the stall to meet,

Sanskit Text: गोष्ठं गाव इवाशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghoṣṭhaṃ ghāva ivāśata ||
Translation: The lowing calf that longs for milk.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्यं ता अङगिरस्तम विश्वाः सुक्षितयः पर्थक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyaṃ tā aṅghirastama viśvāḥ sukṣitayaḥ pṛthak |
Translation: 18 Agni, best Aṅgiras, to thee all people who have pleasant homes,

Sanskit Text: अग्ने कामाय येमिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne kāmāya yemire ||
Translation: Apart, have turned as to their wish.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं धीभिर्मनीषिणो मेधिरासो विपश्चितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ dhībhirmanīṣiṇo medhirāso vipaścitaḥ |
Translation: 19 The sages skilled in holy song and thinkers with their thoughts have urged

Sanskit Text: अद्मसद्याय हिन्विरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: admasadyāya hinvire ||
Translation: Agni to share the sacred feast.

Sanskit Text: तं तवामज्मेषु वाजिनं तन्वाना अग्ने अध्वरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvāmajmeṣu vājinaṃ tanvānā aghne adhvaram |
Translation: 20 So, Agni, unto thee the Priest, Invoker, strong in forays, pray

Sanskit Text: वह्निंहोतारमीळते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vahniṃhotāramīḷate ||
Translation: Those who spin out the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: पुरुत्रा हि सद्रंं असि विशो विश्वा अनु परभुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purutrā hi sadṛṃṃ asi viśo viśvā anu prabhuḥ |
Translation: 21 In many a place, the same in look art thou, a Prince o’er all the tribes

Sanskit Text: समत्सुत्वा हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samatsutvā havāmahe ||
Translation: In battles we invoke thine aid.

Sanskit Text: तमीळिष्व य आहुतो.अग्निर्विभ्राजते घर्तैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamīḷiṣva ya āhuto.aghnirvibhrājate ghṛtaiḥ |
Translation: 22 Pray thou to Agni, pray to him who blazes served with sacred oil:

Sanskit Text: इमं नःश्र्णवद धवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ naḥśṛṇavad dhavam ||
Translation: Let him give ear to this our call.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा वयं हवामहे शर्ण्वन्तं जातवेदसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā vayaṃ havāmahe śṛṇvantaṃ jātavedasam |
Translation: 23 We call on thee as such, as one who hears, as Jātavedas, one,

Sanskit Text: अग्ने घनन्तमप दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne ghnantamapa dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: Agni! who beats away our foes.

Sanskit Text: विशां राजानमद्भुतमध्यक्षं धर्मणामिमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśāṃ rājānamadbhutamadhyakṣaṃ dharmaṇāmimam |
Translation: 24 I pray to Agni, King of men, the Wonderful, the President

Sanskit Text: अग्निमीळे स उ शरवत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnimīḷe sa u śravat ||
Translation: Of holy Laws: may he give ear.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं विश्वायुवेपसं मर्यं न वाजिनं हितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ viśvāyuvepasaṃ maryaṃ na vājinaṃ hitam |
Translation: 25 Him like a bridegroom, him who stirs all people, like a noble horse,

Sanskit Text: सप्तिं न वाजयामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saptiṃ na vājayāmasi ||
Translation: Like a fleet steed, we instigate.

Sanskit Text: घनन मर्ध्राण्यप दविषो दहन रक्षांसि विश्वहा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghnan mṛdhrāṇyapa dviṣo dahan rakṣāṃsi viśvahā |
Translation: 26 Slaying things deadly, burning up foes, Rākṣasas, on every side,

Sanskit Text: अग्नेतिग्मेन दीदिहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnetighmena dīdihi ||
Translation: Shine, Agni, with thy sharpened flame.

Sanskit Text: यं तवा जनास इन्धते मनुष्वदङगिरस्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ tvā janāsa indhate manuṣvadaṅghirastama |
Translation: 27 Thou whom the people kindle even as Manus did, best Aṅgiras!

Sanskit Text: अग्ने स बोधिमे वचः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne sa bodhime vacaḥ ||
Translation: O Agni, mark thou this my speech.

Sanskit Text: यदग्ने दिविजा अस्यप्सुजा वा सहस्क्र्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadaghne divijā asyapsujā vā sahaskṛta |
Translation: 28 O Agni, made by strength! be thou born in the heavens or born in floods,

Sanskit Text: तं तवा गीर्भिर्हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā ghīrbhirhavāmahe ||
Translation: As such we call on thee with songs.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्यं घेत ते जना इमे विश्वाः सुक्षितयः पर्थक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyaṃ ghet te janā ime viśvāḥ sukṣitayaḥ pṛthak |
Translation: 29 Yea, all the people, all the folk who have good dwellings, each apart,

Sanskit Text: धासिं हिन्वन्त्यत्तवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhāsiṃ hinvantyattave ||
Translation: Send food for thee to eat thereof.

Sanskit Text: ते घेदग्ने सवाध्यो.अहा विश्वा नर्चक्षसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te ghedaghne svādhyo.ahā viśvā nṛcakṣasaḥ |
Translation: 30 O Agni, so may we, devout, gazed at by men, throughout our days,

Sanskit Text: तरन्तः सयाम दुर्गहा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tarantaḥ syāma durghahā ||
Translation: Pass lightly over all distress.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं मन्द्रं पुरुप्रियं शीरं पावकशोचिषम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ mandraṃ purupriyaṃ śīraṃ pāvakaśociṣam |
Translation: 31 We venerate with cheerful hearts the cheerful Agni, dear to all,

Sanskit Text: हर्द्भिर्मन्द्रेभिरीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hṛdbhirmandrebhirīmahe ||
Translation: Burning, with purifying flame.

Sanskit Text: स तवमग्ने विभावसुः सर्जन सूर्यो न रश्मिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvamaghne vibhāvasuḥ sṛjan sūryo na raśmibhiḥ |
Translation: 32 So thou, O Agni rich in light, beaming like Sūrya with thy rays

Sanskit Text: शर्धन तमांसि जिघ्नसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śardhan tamāṃsi jighnase ||
Translation: Boldly demolishest the gloom,

Sanskit Text: तत ते सहस्व ईमहे दात्रं यन नोपदस्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat te sahasva īmahe dātraṃ yan nopadasyati |
Translation: 33 We pray to thee for this thy gift, Victor the gift that faileth not,

Sanskit Text: तवदग्ने वार्यं वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvadaghne vāryaṃ vasu ||
Translation: O Agni, choicest wealth from thee.

Sanskit Text: समिधाग्निं दुवस्यत घर्तैर्बोधयतातिथिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samidhāghniṃ duvasyata ghṛtairbodhayatātithim |
Translation: 1. PAY service unto Agni with your fuel, rouse your Guest with oil:

Sanskit Text: आस्मिन हव्याजुहोतन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsmin havyājuhotana ||
Translation: In him present your offerings.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने सतोमं जुषस्व मे वर्धस्वानेन मन्मना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne stomaṃ juṣasva me vardhasvānena manmanā |
Translation: 2 Agni, do thou accept my laud, be magnified by this my song:

Sanskit Text: परति सूक्तानि हर्य नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati sūktāni harya naḥ ||
Translation: Welcome my sweetly-spoken words.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं दूतं पुरो दधे हव्यवाहमुप बरुवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ dūtaṃ puro dadhe havyavāhamupa bruve |
Translation: 3 Agni, envoy, I place in front; the oblation-bearer I address:

Sanskit Text: देवाना सादयादिह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānā sādayādiha ||
Translation: Here let him seat the Deities.

Sanskit Text: उत ते बर्हन्तो अर्चयः समिधानस्य दीदिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut te bṛhanto arcayaḥ samidhānasya dīdivaḥ |
Translation: 4 Agni, the lofty flames of thee enkindled have gone up on high,

Sanskit Text: अग्ने शुक्रासीरते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne śukrāsaīrate ||
Translation: Thy bright flames, thou Refulgent One.

Sanskit Text: उप तवा जुह्वो मम घर्ताचीर्यन्तु हर्यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa tvā juhvo mama ghṛtācīryantu haryata |
Translation: 5 Beloved! let my ladles full of sacred oil come near to thee:

Sanskit Text: अग्ने हव्या जुषस्व नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne havyā juṣasva naḥ ||
Translation: Agni, accept our offerings.

Sanskit Text: मन्द्रं होतारं रत्विजं चित्रभानुं विभावसुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mandraṃ hotāraṃ ṛtvijaṃ citrabhānuṃ vibhāvasum |
Translation: 6 I worship Agni—may he hear!—the cheerful, the Invoker, Priest,

Sanskit Text: अग्निमीळे स उ शरवत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnimīḷe sa u śravat ||
Translation: Of varied splendour, rich in light.

Sanskit Text: परत्नं होतारमीड्यं जुष्टमग्निं कविक्रतुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratnaṃ hotāramīḍyaṃ juṣṭamaghniṃ kavikratum |
Translation: 7 Ancient Invoker, meet for praise, beloved Agni, wise and strong,

Sanskit Text: अध्वराणामभिश्रियम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhvarāṇāmabhiśriyam ||
Translation: The visitant of solemn rites.

Sanskit Text: जुषानो अङगिरस्तमेमा हव्यान्यानुषक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣāno aṅghirastamemā havyānyānuṣak |
Translation: 8 Agni, best Aṅgiras, accept straightway these offerings, and guide

Sanskit Text: अग्ने यज्ञं नयर्तुथा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne yajñaṃ nayaṛtuthā ||
Translation: The seasonable sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: समिधान उ सन्त्य शुक्रशोच इहा वह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samidhāna u santya śukraśoca ihā vaha |
Translation: 9 Excellent God, with brilliant flames, enkindled bring thou hitherward,

Sanskit Text: चिकित्वान दैव्यं जनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cikitvān daivyaṃ janam ||
Translation: Knowing the way, the Heavenly Host.

Sanskit Text: विप्रं होतारमद्रुहं धूमकेतुं विभावसुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vipraṃ hotāramadruhaṃ dhūmaketuṃ vibhāvasum |
Translation: 10 Him, Sage and Herald, void of guile, ensign of sacrifices, him

Sanskit Text: यज्ञानां केतुमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñānāṃ ketumīmahe ||
Translation: Smoke-bannered, rich in light, we seek.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने नि पाहि नस्त्वं परति षम देव रीषतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne ni pāhi nastvaṃ prati ṣma deva rīṣataḥ |
Translation: 11 O Agni, be our Guardian thou, God, against those who injure us:

Sanskit Text: भिन्धि दवेषः सहस्क्र्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhindhi dveṣaḥ sahaskṛta ||
Translation: Destroy our foes, thou Son of Strength.

Sanskit Text: अग्निः परत्नेन मन्मना शुम्भानस्तन्वं सवाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniḥ pratnena manmanā śumbhānastanvaṃ svām |
Translation: 12 Making his body beautiful, Agni the Sage hath waxen by

Sanskit Text: कविर्विप्रेण वाव्र्धे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kavirvipreṇa vāvṛdhe ||
Translation: The singer and his ancient hymn.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्जो नपातमा हुवे.अग्निं पावकशोचिषम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrjo napātamā huve.aghniṃ pāvakaśociṣam |
Translation: 13 I invocate the Child of Strength, Agni with purifying flame,

Sanskit Text: अस्मिन यज्ञे सवध्वरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmin yajñe svadhvare ||
Translation: At this well-ordered sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: स नो मित्रमहस्त्वमग्ने शुक्रेण सोचिषा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no mitramahastvamaghne śukreṇa sociṣā |
Translation: 14 So Agni, rich in many friends, with fiery splendour, seat thyself

Sanskit Text: देवैरा सत्सिबर्हिषि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devairā satsibarhiṣi ||
Translation: With Gods upon our sacred grass.

Sanskit Text: यो अग्निं तन्वो दमे देवं मर्तः सपर्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo aghniṃ tanvo dame devaṃ martaḥ saparyati |
Translation: 15 The mortal man who serves the God Agni within his own abode,

Sanskit Text: तस्मा इद दीदयद वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmā id dīdayad vasu ||
Translation: For him he causes wealth to shine.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्मूर्धा दिवः ककुत पतिः पर्थिव्या अयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirmūrdhā divaḥ kakut patiḥ pṛthivyā ayam |
Translation: 16 Agni is head and height of heaven, the Master of the earth is he:

Sanskit Text: अपां रेतांसि जिन्वति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāṃ retāṃsi jinvati ||
Translation: He quickeneth the waters’ seed.

Sanskit Text: उदग्ने शुचयस्तव शुक्रा भराजन्त ईरते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udaghne śucayastava śukrā bhrājanta īrate |
Translation: 17 Upward, O Agni, rise thy flames, pure and resplendent, blazing high,

Sanskit Text: तव जयोतींष्यर्चयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava jyotīṃṣyarcayaḥ ||
Translation: Thy lustres, fair effulgences.

Sanskit Text: ईषिषे वार्यस्य हि दात्रस्याग्ने सवर्पतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īṣiṣe vāryasya hi dātrasyāghne svarpatiḥ |
Translation: 18 For, Agni, thou as Lord of Light rulest o’er choicest gifts: may I,

Sanskit Text: सतोता सयां तव शर्मणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stotā syāṃ tava śarmaṇi ||
Translation: Thy singer, find defence in thee.

Sanskit Text: तवामग्ने मनीषिणस्त्वां हिन्वन्ति चित्तिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmaghne manīṣiṇastvāṃ hinvanti cittibhiḥ |
Translation: 19 O Agni, they who understand stir thee to action with their thoughts:

Sanskit Text: तवां वर्धन्तु नो गिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ vardhantu no ghiraḥ ||
Translation: So let our songs enhance thy might.

Sanskit Text: अदब्धस्य सवधावतो दूतस्य रेभतः सदा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adabdhasya svadhāvato dūtasya rebhataḥ sadā |
Translation: 20 We ever claim the friendship of Agni, the singing messenger,

Sanskit Text: अग्नेः सख्यं वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghneḥ sakhyaṃ vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: Of God-like nature, void of guile.

Sanskit Text: अग्निः शुचिव्रततमः शुचिर्विप्रः शुचिः कविः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniḥ śucivratatamaḥ śucirvipraḥ śuciḥ kaviḥ |
Translation: 21 Agni who bears most holy sway, the holy Singer, holy Sage,

Sanskit Text: शुचीरोचत आहुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śucīrocata āhutaḥ ||
Translation: Shines holy when we worship him.

Sanskit Text: उत तवा धीतयो मम गिरो वर्धन्तु विश्वहा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tvā dhītayo mama ghiro vardhantu viśvahā |
Translation: 22 Yea, let my meditations, let my songs exalt thee evermore.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने सख्यस्य बोधि नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne sakhyasya bodhi naḥ ||
Translation: Think, Agni, of our friendly bond,

Sanskit Text: यदग्ने सयामहं तवं तवं वा घा सया अहम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadaghne syāmahaṃ tvaṃ tvaṃ vā ghā syā aham |
Translation: 23 If I were thou and thou wert I, O Agni, every prayer of thine

Sanskit Text: सयुष टे सत्या इहाशिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: syuṣ ṭe satyā ihāśiṣaḥ ||
Translation: Should have its due fulfilment here.

Sanskit Text: वसुर्वसुपतिर्हि कमस्यग्ने विभावसुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasurvasupatirhi kamasyaghne vibhāvasuḥ |
Translation: 24 For Excellent and Lord of wealth. art thou O Agni, rich in light:

Sanskit Text: सयाम ते सुमतावपि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: syāma te sumatāvapi ||
Translation: May we enjoy thy favouring grace.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने धर्तव्रताय ते समुद्रायेव सिन्धवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne dhṛtavratāya te samudrāyeva sindhavaḥ |
Translation: 25 Agni, to thee whose laws stand fast our resonant songs of praise speed forth,

Sanskit Text: गिरो वाश्रासीरते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghiro vāśrāsaīrate ||
Translation: As rivers hasten to the sea.

Sanskit Text: युवानं विश्पतिं कविं विश्वादं पुरुवेपसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvānaṃ viśpatiṃ kaviṃ viśvādaṃ puruvepasam |
Translation: 26 Agni, the Youthful Lord of men, who stirreth much and eateth all,

Sanskit Text: अग्निं शुम्भामि मन्मभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ śumbhāmi manmabhiḥ ||
Translation: The Sage, I glorify with hymns.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञानां रथ्ये वयं तिग्मजम्भाय वीळवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñānāṃ rathye vayaṃ tighmajambhāya vīḷave |
Translation: 27 To Agni let us haste with lauds, the Guide of sacrificial rites,

Sanskit Text: सतोमैरिषेमाग्नये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stomairiṣemāghnaye ||
Translation: Armed with sharp teeth, the Mighty One.

Sanskit Text: अयमग्ने तवे अपि जरिता भूतु सन्त्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayamaghne tve api jaritā bhūtu santya |
Translation: 28 And let this man, good Agni, be with thee the singer of thy praise:

Sanskit Text: तस्मै पावक मर्ळय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmai pāvaka mṛḷaya ||
Translation: Be gracious, Holy One, to him.

Sanskit Text: धीरो हयस्यद्मसद विप्रो न जाग्र्विः सदा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhīro hyasyadmasad vipro na jāghṛviḥ sadā |
Translation: 29 For thou art sharer of our feast, wise, ever watchful as a Sage:

Sanskit Text: अग्ने दीदयसि दयवि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne dīdayasi dyavi ||
Translation: Agni, thou shinest in the sky.

Sanskit Text: पुराग्ने दुरितेभ्यः पुरा मर्ध्रेभ्यः कवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purāghne duritebhyaḥ purā mṛdhrebhyaḥ kave |
Translation: 30 O Agni, Sage, before our foes, before misfortunes fall on us,

Sanskit Text: पर ण आयुर्वसो तिर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ṇa āyurvaso tira ||
Translation: Excellent Lord, prolong our lives.

Sanskit Text: सवादोरभक्षि वयसः सुमेधाः सवाध्यो वरिवोवित्तरस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svādorabhakṣi vayasaḥ sumedhāḥ svādhyo varivovittarasya |
Translation: 1. WISELY have I enjoyed the savoury viand, religious-thoughted, best to find out treasure,

Sanskit Text: विश्वे यं देवा उत मर्त्यासो मधु बरुवन्तो अभि संचरन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve yaṃ devā uta martyāso madhu bruvanto abhi saṃcaranti ||
Translation: The food to which all Deities and mortals, calling it meath, gather themselves together.

Sanskit Text: अन्तश्च परागा अदितिर्भवास्यवयाता हरसो दैव्यस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: antaśca prāghā aditirbhavāsyavayātā haraso daivyasya |
Translation: 2 Tlou shalt be Aditi as thou hast entered within, appeaser of celestial anger.

Sanskit Text: इन्दविन्द्रस्य सख्यं जुषाणः शरौष्टीव धुरमनु राय रध्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indavindrasya sakhyaṃ juṣāṇaḥ śrauṣṭīva dhuramanu rāya ṛdhyāḥ ||
Translation: Indu, enjoying Indra's friendship, bring us—as a swift steed the car—forward to riches.

Sanskit Text: अपाम सोममम्र्ता अभूमागन्म जयोतिरविदाम देवान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāma somamamṛtā abhūmāghanma jyotiravidāma devān |
Translation: 3 We have drunk Soma and become immortal; we have attained the light, the Gods discovered.

Sanskit Text: किं नूनमस्मान कर्णवदरातिः किमु धूर्तिरम्र्त मर्त्यस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kiṃ nūnamasmān kṛṇavadarātiḥ kimu dhūrtiramṛta martyasya ||
Translation: Now what may foeman's malice do to harm us? What, O Immortal, mortal man's deception?

Sanskit Text: शं नो भव हर्द आ पीत इन्दो पितेव सोम सूनवे सुशेवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no bhava hṛda ā pīta indo piteva soma sūnave suśevaḥ |
Translation: 4 Absorbed into the heart, be sweet, O Indu, as a kind father to his son, O Soma,

Sanskit Text: सखेव सख्य उरुशंस धीरः पर ण आयुर्जीवसे सोमतारीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakheva sakhya uruśaṃsa dhīraḥ pra ṇa āyurjīvase somatārīḥ ||
Translation: As a wise Friend to friend: do thou, wide-ruler, O Soma, lengthen out our days for living.

Sanskit Text: इमे मा पीता यशस उरुष्यवो रथं न गावः समनाहपर्वसु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime mā pītā yaśasa uruṣyavo rathaṃ na ghāvaḥ samanāhaparvasu |
Translation: 5 These glorious drops that give me freedom have I drunk. Closely they knit my joints as straps secure a car.

Sanskit Text: ते मा रक्षन्तु विस्रसश्चरित्रादुत मा सरामाद्यवयन्त्विन्दवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te mā rakṣantu visrasaścaritrāduta mā srāmādyavayantvindavaḥ ||
Translation: Let them protect my foot from slipping on the way: yea, let the drops I drink preserve me from disease.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं न मा मथितं सं दिदीपः पर चक्षय कर्णुहि वस्यसो नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ na mā mathitaṃ saṃ didīpaḥ pra cakṣaya kṛṇuhi vasyaso naḥ |
Translation: 6 Make me shine bright like fire produced by friction: give us a clearer sight and make us better.

Sanskit Text: अथा हि ते मद आ सोम मन्ये रेवानिव पर चरापुष्टिमछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā hi te mada ā soma manye revāniva pra carāpuṣṭimacha ||
Translation: For in carouse I think of thee, O Soma, Shall I, as a rich man, attain to comfort?

Sanskit Text: इषिरेण ते मनसा सुतस्य भक्षीमहि पित्र्यस्येव रायः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣireṇa te manasā sutasya bhakṣīmahi pitryasyeva rāyaḥ |
Translation: 7 May we enjoy with an enlivened spirit the juice thou givest, like ancestral riches.

Sanskit Text: सोम राजन पर ण आयूंषि तारीरहानीव सूर्यो वासराणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: soma rājan pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tārīrahānīva sūryo vāsarāṇi ||
Translation: O Soma, King, prolong thou our existence as Sūrya makes the shining days grow longer.

Sanskit Text: सोम राजन मर्ळया नः सवस्ति तव समसि वरत्यास्तस्य विद्धि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: soma rājan mṛḷayā naḥ svasti tava smasi vratyāstasya viddhi |
Translation: 8 King Soma, favour us and make us prosper: we are thy devotees; of this be mindful.

Sanskit Text: अलर्ति दक्ष उत मन्युरिन्दो मा नो अर्यो अनुकामं परादाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: alarti dakṣa uta manyurindo mā no aryo anukāmaṃ parādāḥ ||
Translation: Spirit and power are fresh in us, O Indu give us not up unto our foeman's pleasure.

Sanskit Text: तवं हि नस्तन्वः सोम गोपा गात्रे-गात्रे निषसत्था नर्चक्षाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hi nastanvaḥ soma ghopā ghātre-ghātre niṣasatthā nṛcakṣāḥ |
Translation: 9 For thou hast settled in each joint, O Soma, aim of men's eyes and guardian of our bodies.

Sanskit Text: यत ते वयं परमिनाम वरतानि स नो मर्ळ सुषखादेव वस्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te vayaṃ pramināma vratāni sa no mṛḷa suṣakhādeva vasyaḥ ||
Translation: When we offend against thine holy statutes, as a kind Friend, God, best of all, be gracious.

Sanskit Text: रदूदरेण साख्या सचेय यो मा न रिष्येद धर्यश्व पीतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛdūdareṇa sākhyā saceya yo mā na riṣyed dharyaśva pītaḥ |
Translation: 10 May I be with the Friend whose heart is tender, who, Lord of Bays! when quaffed will never harm me-

Sanskit Text: अयं यः सोमो नयधाय्यस्मे तस्मा इन्द्रं परतिरमेम्यायुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ yaḥ somo nyadhāyyasme tasmā indraṃ pratiramemyāyuḥ ||
Translation: This Soma now deposited within me. For this, I pray for longer life to Indra.

Sanskit Text: अप तया अस्थुरनिरा अमीवा निरत्रसन तमिषीचीरभैषुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa tyā asthuranirā amīvā niratrasan tamiṣīcīrabhaiṣuḥ |
Translation: 11 Our maladies have lost their strength and vanished: they feared, and passed away into the darkness.

Sanskit Text: आ सोमो अस्मानरुहद विहाया अगन्म यत्र परतिरन्त आयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā somo asmānaruhad vihāyā aghanma yatra pratiranta āyuḥ ||
Translation: Soma hath risen in us, exceeding mighty, and we are come where men prolong existence.

Sanskit Text: यो न इन्दुः पितरो हर्त्सु पीतो.अमर्त्यो मर्त्यानाविवेश |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo na induḥ pitaro hṛtsu pīto.amartyo martyānāviveśa |
Translation: 12, Fathers, that Indu which our hearts have drunken, Immortal in himself, hath entered mortals.

Sanskit Text: तस्मै सोमाय हविषा विधेम मर्ळीके अस्य सुमतौ सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmai somāya haviṣā vidhema mṛḷīke asya sumatau syāma ||
Translation: So let us serve this Soma with oblation, and rest securely in his grace and favour.

Sanskit Text: तवं सोम पित्र्भिः संविदानो.अनु दयावाप्र्थिवी आ ततन्थ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ soma pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidāno.anu dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatantha |
Translation: 13 Associate with the Fathers thou, O Soma, hast spread thyself abroad through earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: तस्मै त इन्दो हविषा विधेम वयं सयाम पतयो रयीणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmai ta indo haviṣā vidhema vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām ||
Translation: So with oblation let us serve thee, Indu, and so let us become the lords of riches,

Sanskit Text: तरातारो देवा अधि वोचता नो मा नो निद्रा ईशत मोत जल्पिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trātāro devā adhi vocatā no mā no nidrā īśata mota jalpiḥ |
Translation: 14 Give us your blessing, O ye Gods’ preservers. Never may sleep or idle talk control us.

Sanskit Text: वयं सोमस्य विश्वह परियासः सुवीरासो विदथमावदेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ somasya viśvaha priyāsaḥ suvīrāso vidathamāvadema ||
Translation: But evermore may we, as friends of Soma, speak to the synod with brave sons around us.

Sanskit Text: तवं नः सोम विश्वतो वयोधास्त्वं सवर्विदा विशा नर्चक्षाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ soma viśvato vayodhāstvaṃ svarvidā viśā nṛcakṣāḥ |
Translation: 15 On all sides,. Soma, thou art our life-giver: aim of all eyes, light-finder, come within us.

Sanskit Text: तवं न इन्द ऊतिभिः सजोषाः पाहि पश्चातादुत वा पुरस्तात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ na inda ūtibhiḥ sajoṣāḥ pāhi paścātāduta vā purastāt ||
Translation: Indu, of one accord with thy protections both from behind and from before preserve us.

Sanskit Text: उभयं शर्णवच्च न इन्द्रो अर्वागिदं वचः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhayaṃ śṛṇavacca na indro arvāghidaṃ vacaḥ |
Translation: 1. PREPARE oblation: let him come; and let the minister serve again

Sanskit Text: सत्राच्यामघवा सोमपीतये धिया शविष्ठ आ गमत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satrācyāmaghavā somapītaye dhiyā śaviṣṭha ā ghamat ||
Translation: Who knows the ordering thereof,

Sanskit Text: तं हि सवराजं वर्षभं तमोजसे धिषणे निष्टतक्षतुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ hi svarājaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ tamojase dhiṣaṇe niṣṭatakṣatuḥ |
Translation: 2 Rejoicing in his friendship, let the priest be seated over man,

Sanskit Text: उतोपमानां परथमो नि षीदसि सोमकामं हि ते मनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utopamānāṃ prathamo ni ṣīdasi somakāmaṃ hi te manaḥ ||
Translation: Beside the shoot of active power.

Sanskit Text: आ वर्षस्व पुरूवसो सुतस्येन्द्रान्धसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vṛṣasva purūvaso sutasyendrāndhasaḥ |
Translation: 3 Him, glowing bright beyond all thought, they seek among the race of man;

Sanskit Text: विद्मा हि तवा हरिवः पर्त्सु सासहिमध्र्ष्टं चिद दध्र्ष्वणिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidmā hi tvā harivaḥ pṛtsu sāsahimadhṛṣṭaṃ cid dadhṛṣvaṇim ||
Translation: With him for

Sanskit Text: <a href="errata.htm#24">
tongue
they seize the food.
अप्रामिसत्य मघवन तथेदसदिन्द्र करत्वा यथा वशः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aprāmisatya maghavan tathedasadindra kratvā yathā vaśaḥ |
Translation: 4 He hath inflamed the twofold plain: life-giving, he hath climbed the wood,

Sanskit Text: सनेम वाजं तव शिप्रिन्नवसा मक्षू चिद यन्तो अद्रिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanema vājaṃ tava śiprinnavasā makṣū cid yanto adrivaḥ ||
Translation: And with his tongue hath struck the rock.

Sanskit Text: शग्ध्यू षु शचीपत इन्द्र विश्वाभिरूतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaghdhyū ṣu śacīpata indra viśvābhirūtibhiḥ |
Translation: 5 Wandering here the radiant Calf finds none to fetter him, and seeks

Sanskit Text: भगंन हि तवा यशसं वसुविदमनु शूर चरामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhaghaṃna hi tvā yaśasaṃ vasuvidamanu śūra carāmasi ||
Translation: The Mother to declare his praise.

Sanskit Text: पौरो अश्वस्य पुरुक्र्द गवामस्युत्सो देव हिरण्ययः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pauro aśvasya purukṛd ghavāmasyutso deva hiraṇyayaḥ |
Translation: 6 And now that great and mighty team, the team of horses that are his,

Sanskit Text: नकिर्हि दानं परिमर्धिषत तवे यद-यद यामि तदा भर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nakirhi dānaṃ parimardhiṣat tve yad-yad yāmi tadā bhara ||
Translation: And traces of his car, are seen.

Sanskit Text: तवं हयेहि चेरवे विदा भगं वसुत्तये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hyehi cerave vidā bhaghaṃ vasuttaye |
Translation: 7 The seven milk a single cow; the two set other five to work,

Sanskit Text: उद वाव्र्षस्व मघवन गविष्टय उदिन्द्राश्वमिष्टये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud vāvṛṣasva maghavan ghaviṣṭaya udindrāśvamiṣṭaye ||
Translation: On the stream's loud-resounding bank.

Sanskit Text: तवं पुरू सहस्राणि शतानि च यूथा दानाय मंहसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ purū sahasrāṇi śatāni ca yūthā dānāya maṃhase |
Translation: 8 Entreated by Vivasvān's ten, Indra cast down the water-jar

Sanskit Text: आ पुरन्दरं चक्र्म विप्रवचस इन्द्रं गायन्तो.अवसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā purandaraṃ cakṛma vipravacasa indraṃ ghāyanto.avase ||
Translation: With threefold hammer from the sky.

Sanskit Text: अविप्रो वा यदविधद विप्रो वेन्द्र ते वचः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avipro vā yadavidhad vipro vendra te vacaḥ |
Translation: 9 Three times the newly-kindled flame proceeds around the sacrifice:

Sanskit Text: स पर ममन्दत्त्वाया शतक्रतो पराचामन्यो अहंसन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pra mamandattvāyā śatakrato prācāmanyo ahaṃsana ||
Translation: The priests anoint it with the meath.

Sanskit Text: उग्रबाहुर्म्रक्षक्र्त्वा पुरन्दरो यदि मे शर्णवद धवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughrabāhurmrakṣakṛtvā purandaro yadi me śṛṇavad dhavam |
Translation: 10 With reverence they drain the fount that circles with its wheel above,

Sanskit Text: वसूयवो वसुपतिं शतक्रतुं सतोमैरिन्द्रं हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasūyavo vasupatiṃ śatakratuṃ stomairindraṃ havāmahe ||
Translation: Exhaustless, with the mouth below.

Sanskit Text: न पापासो मनामहे नारायासो न जळ्हवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na pāpāso manāmahe nārāyāso na jaḷhavaḥ |
Translation: 11 The pressing-stones are set at work: the meath is poured into the tank,

Sanskit Text: यदिन नविन्द्रं वर्षणं सचा सुते सखायं कर्णवामहै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadin nvindraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ sacā sute sakhāyaṃ kṛṇavāmahai ||
Translation: At the out-shedding of the fount.

Sanskit Text: उग्रं युयुज्म पर्तनासु सासहिं रणकातिमदाभ्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughraṃ yuyujma pṛtanāsu sāsahiṃ ṛṇakātimadābhyam |
Translation: 12 Ye cows, protect the fount: the two Mighty Ones bless the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: वेदा भर्मं चित सनिता रथीतमो वाजिनं यमिदू नशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vedā bhṛmaṃ cit sanitā rathītamo vājinaṃ yamidū naśat ||
Translation: The handles twain are wrought of gold.

Sanskit Text: यत इन्द्र भयामहे ततो नो अभयं कर्धि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yata indra bhayāmahe tato no abhayaṃ kṛdhi |
Translation: 13 Pour on the juice the ornament which reaches both the heaven and earth

Sanskit Text: मघवञ्छग्धितव तन न ऊतिभिर्वि दविषो वि मर्धो जहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maghavañchaghdhitava tan na ūtibhirvi dviṣo vi mṛdho jahi ||
Translation: Supply the liquid to the Bull.

Sanskit Text: तवं हि राधस्पते राधसो महः कषयस्यासि विधतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hi rādhaspate rādhaso mahaḥ kṣayasyāsi vidhataḥ |
Translation: 14 These know their own abiding-place: like calves beside the mother cows

Sanskit Text: तं तवा वयं मघवन्निन्द्र गिर्वणः सुतावन्तो हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā vayaṃ maghavannindra ghirvaṇaḥ sutāvanto havāmahe ||
Translation: They meet together with their kin.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र सपळ उत वर्त्रहा परस्पा नो वरेण्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra spaḷ uta vṛtrahā paraspā no vareṇyaḥ |
Translation: 15 Devouring in their greedy jaws, they make sustaining food in heaven,

Sanskit Text: स नो रक्षिषच्चरमं स मध्यमं स पश्चात पातु नः पुरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no rakṣiṣaccaramaṃ sa madhyamaṃ sa paścāt pātu naḥ puraḥ ||
Translation: To Indra, Agni light and prayer.

Sanskit Text: तवं नः पश्चादधरादुत्तरात पुर इन्द्र नि पाहि विश्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ paścādadharāduttarāt pura indra ni pāhi viśvataḥ |
Translation: 16 The Pious One milked out rich food, sustenance dealt in portions seven,

Sanskit Text: आरे अस्मत कर्णुहि दैव्यं भयमारे हेतीरदेवीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āre asmat kṛṇuhi daivyaṃ bhayamāre hetīradevīḥ ||
Translation: Together with the Sun's seven rays.

Sanskit Text: अद्याद्या शवः-शव इन्द्र तरास्व परे च नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adyādyā śvaḥ-śva indra trāsva pare ca naḥ |
Translation: 17 I took some Soma when the Sun rose up, O Mitra, Varuṇa.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा च नोजरितॄन सत्पते अहा दिवा नक्तं च रक्षिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā ca nojaritṝn satpate ahā divā naktaṃ ca rakṣiṣaḥ ||
Translation: That is the sick man's medicine.

Sanskit Text: परभङगी शूरो मघवा तुवीमघः सम्मिष्लो विर्याय कम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prabhaṅghī śūro maghavā tuvīmaghaḥ sammiṣlo viryāya kam |
Translation: 18 From where oblations must be laid, which is the Well-beloved's home,

Sanskit Text: उभा ते बाहू वर्षणा शतक्रतो नि या वज्रं मिमिक्षतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhā te bāhū vṛṣaṇā śatakrato ni yā vajraṃ mimikṣatuḥ ||
Translation: He with his tongue hath compassed heaven.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्र परागपागुदं नयग वा हूयसे नर्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindra prāghapāghudaṃ nyagh vā hūyase nṛbhiḥ |
Translation: 1. NOT to forsake me, I invoke this Indra girt by Maruts,

Sanskit Text: आ याहि तूयमाशुभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yāhi tūyamāśubhiḥ ||
Translation: Lord Of magic power who rules with might.

Sanskit Text: यद वा परस्रवणे दिवो मादयासे सवर्णरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā prasravaṇe divo mādayāse svarṇare |
Translation: 2 This Indra with his Marut Friends clave into pieces Vṛtra's bead

Sanskit Text: यद वा समुद्रेन्धसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā samudreandhasaḥ ||
Translation: With hundred-knotted thunderbolt.

Sanskit Text: आ तवा गीर्भिर्महामुरुं हुवे गामिव भोजसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tvā ghīrbhirmahāmuruṃ huve ghāmiva bhojase |
Translation: 3 Indra, with Marut Friends grown strong, hath rent asunder Vṛtra, and

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र सोमस्य पीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra somasya pītaye ||
Translation: Released the waters of the sea.

Sanskit Text: आ त इन्द्र महिमानं हरयो देव ते महः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ta indra mahimānaṃ harayo deva te mahaḥ |
Translation: 4 This is that Indra who, begirt by Maruts, won the light of heaven

Sanskit Text: रथे वहन्तु बिभ्रतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathe vahantu bibhrataḥ ||
Translation: That he might drink the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र गर्णीष उ सतुषे महानुग्र ईशानक्र्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra ghṛṇīṣa u stuṣe mahānughra īśānakṛt |
Translation: 5 Mighty, impetuous, begirt by Maruts, him who loudly roars,

Sanskit Text: एहि नः सुतं पिब ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ehi naḥ sutaṃ piba ||
Translation: Indra we invocate with songs.

Sanskit Text: सुतावन्तस्त्वा वयं परयस्वन्तो हवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sutāvantastvā vayaṃ prayasvanto havāmahe |
Translation: 6 Indra begirt by Maruts we invoke after the ancient plan,

Sanskit Text: इदं नो बर्हिरासदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ no barhirāsade ||
Translation: That he may drink the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: यच्चिद धि शश्वतामसीन्द्र साधारणस्त्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaccid dhi śaśvatāmasīndra sādhāraṇastvam |
Translation: 7 O liberal Indra, Marut-girt, much-lauded Śatakratu, drink

Sanskit Text: तं तवा वयं हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā vayaṃ havāmahe ||
Translation: The Soma at this sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: इदं ते सोम्यं मध्वधुक्षन्नद्रिभिर्नरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ te somyaṃ madhvadhukṣannadribhirnaraḥ |
Translation: 8 To thee, O Indra, Marut-girt, these Soma juices, Thunderer!

Sanskit Text: जुषाण इन्द्र तत पिब ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣāṇa indra tat piba ||
Translation: Are offered from the heart with lauds.

Sanskit Text: विश्वानर्यो विपश्चितो.अति खयस्तूयमा गहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvānaryo vipaścito.ati khyastūyamā ghahi |
Translation: 9 Drink, Indra, with thy Marut Friends, pressed Soma at the morning rites,

Sanskit Text: अस्मे धेहिश्रवो बर्हत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme dhehiśravo bṛhat ||
Translation: Whetting thy thunderbolt with strength.

Sanskit Text: दाता मे पर्षतीनां राजा हिरण्यवीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dātā me pṛṣatīnāṃ rājā hiraṇyavīnām |
Translation: 10 Arising in thy might, thy jaws thou shookest, Indra, having quaffed

Sanskit Text: मा देवा मघवा रिषत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā devā maghavā riṣat ||
Translation: The Soma which the mortar pressed.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रे पर्षतीनामधि शचन्द्रं बर्हत पर्थु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasre pṛṣatīnāmadhi ścandraṃ bṛhat pṛthu |
Translation: 11 Indra, both worlds complained to thee when uttering thy fearful roar,

Sanskit Text: शुक्रं हिरण्यमा ददे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śukraṃ hiraṇyamā dade ||
Translation: What time thou smotest Dasyus dead.

Sanskit Text: नपातो दुर्गहस्य मे सहस्रेण सुराधसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: napāto durghahasya me sahasreṇa surādhasaḥ |
Translation: 12 From Indra have I measured out a song eight-footed with nine parts,

Sanskit Text: शरवो देवेष्वक्रत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śravo deveṣvakrata ||
Translation: Delicate, faithful. to the Law.

Sanskit Text: परेष्ठं वो अतिथिं सतुषे मित्रमिव परियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: preṣṭhaṃ vo atithiṃ stuṣe mitramiva priyam |
Translation: 1. SONG-LOVER! like a charioteer come songs to thee when Soma flows.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं रथं न वेद्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ rathaṃ na vedyam ||
Translation: O Indra, they have called to thee as mother-kine unto their calves.

Sanskit Text: कविमिव परचेतसं यं देवासो अध दविता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kavimiva pracetasaṃ yaṃ devāso adha dvitā |
Translation: 2 Bright juices bitherward have sped thee, Indra, Lover of the Song.

Sanskit Text: नि मर्त्येष्वादधुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni martyeṣvādadhuḥ ||
Translation: Drink, Indra, of this flowing sap: in every house ’tis set for thee.

Sanskit Text: तवं यविष्ठ दाशुषो नॄन पाहि शर्णुधी गिरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ yaviṣṭha dāśuṣo nṝn pāhi śṛṇudhī ghiraḥ |
Translation: 3 Drink Soma to inspirit thee, juice, Indra, which the Falcon brought:

Sanskit Text: रक्षा तोकमुत तमना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rakṣā tokamuta tmanā ||
Translation: For thou art King and Sovran Lord of all the families of men.

Sanskit Text: कया ते अग्ने अङगिर ऊर्जो नपादुपस्तुतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kayā te aghne aṅghira ūrjo napādupastutim |
Translation: 4 O Indra, hear Tirasci's call, the call of him who serveth thee.

Sanskit Text: वराय देव मन्यवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: varāya deva manyave ||
Translation: Satisfy him with wealth of kine and valiant offspring: Great art thou.

Sanskit Text: दाशेम कस्य मनसा यज्ञस्य सहसो यहो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dāśema kasya manasā yajñasya sahaso yaho |
Translation: 5 For he, O Indra, hath produced for thee the newest gladdening song,

Sanskit Text: कदु वोच इदंनमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadu voca idaṃnamaḥ ||
Translation: A hymn that springs from careful thought, ancient, and full of sacred truth.

Sanskit Text: अधा तवं हि नस करो विश्वा अस्मभ्यं सुक्षितीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā tvaṃ hi nas karo viśvā asmabhyaṃ sukṣitīḥ |
Translation: 6 That Indra will we laud whom songs and hymns of praise have magnified.

Sanskit Text: वाजद्रविणसो गिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājadraviṇaso ghiraḥ ||
Translation: Striving to win, we celebrate his many deeds of hero might.

Sanskit Text: कस्य नूनं परीणसो धियो जिन्वसि दम्पते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kasya nūnaṃ parīṇaso dhiyo jinvasi dampate |
Translation: 7 Come now and let us glorify pure Indra with pure Sāma hymns.

Sanskit Text: गोषाता यस्यते गिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghoṣātā yasyate ghiraḥ ||
Translation: Let the pure milky draught delight him strengthened by pure songs of praise.

Sanskit Text: तं मर्जयन्त सुक्रतुं पुरोयावानमाजिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ marjayanta sukratuṃ puroyāvānamājiṣu |
Translation: 8 O Indra, come thou pure to us, with pure assistance, pure thyself.

Sanskit Text: सवेषु कषयेषुवाजिनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sveṣu kṣayeṣuvājinam ||
Translation: Pure, send thou riches down to us, and, meet for Soma, pure, be glad.

Sanskit Text: कषेति कषेमेभिः साधुभिर्नकिर्यं घनन्ति हन्ति यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣeti kṣemebhiḥ sādhubhirnakiryaṃ ghnanti hanti yaḥ |
Translation: 9 O Indra, pure, vouchsafe us wealth, and, pure, enrich the worshipper.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने सुवीर एधते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne suvīra edhate ||
Translation: Pure, thou dost strike the Vṛtras dead, and strivest, pure, to win the spoil.

Sanskit Text: पवस्व देववीरति पवित्रं सोम रंह्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva devavīrati pavitraṃ soma raṃhyā |
Translation: 1. Soma, flow on, inviting Gods, speed to the purifying cloth:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रमिन्दो वर्षा विश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indramindo vṛṣā viśa ||
Translation: Pass into Indra, as a Bull.

Sanskit Text: आ वच्यस्व महि पसरो वर्षेन्दो दयुम्नवत्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vacyasva mahi psaro vṛṣendo dyumnavattamaḥ |
Translation: 2 As mighty food speed hitherward, Indu, as a most splendid Steer:

Sanskit Text: आ योनिं धर्णसिः सदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yoniṃ dharṇasiḥ sadaḥ ||
Translation: Sit in thy place as one with strength.

Sanskit Text: अधुक्षत परियं मधु धारा सुतस्य वेधसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhukṣata priyaṃ madhu dhārā sutasya vedhasaḥ |
Translation: 3 The well-loved meath was made to flow, the stream of the creative juice

Sanskit Text: अपो वसिष्ट सुक्रतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apo vasiṣṭa sukratuḥ ||
Translation: ne Sage drew waters to himself.

Sanskit Text: महान्तं तवा महीरन्वापो अर्षन्ति सिन्धवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahāntaṃ tvā mahīranvāpo arṣanti sindhavaḥ |
Translation: 4 The mighty waters, yea, the floods accompany thee Mighty One,

Sanskit Text: यद गोभिर्वासयिष्यसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad ghobhirvāsayiṣyase ||
Translation: When thou wilt clothe thee with the milk.

Sanskit Text: समुद्रो अप्सु माम्र्जे विष्टम्भो धरुणो दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samudro apsu māmṛje viṣṭambho dharuṇo divaḥ |
Translation: 5 The lake is brightened in the floods. Soma, our Friend, heaven's prop and stay,

Sanskit Text: सोमः पवित्रे अस्मयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaḥ pavitre asmayuḥ ||
Translation: Falls on the purifying cloth.

Sanskit Text: अचिक्रदद वर्षा हरिर्महान मित्रो न दर्शतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: acikradad vṛṣā harirmahān mitro na darśataḥ |
Translation: 6 The tawny Bull hath bellowed, fair as mighty Mitra to behold:

Sanskit Text: सं सूर्येण रोचते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ sūryeṇa rocate ||
Translation: He shines together with the Sun.

Sanskit Text: गिरस्त इन्द ओजसा मर्म्र्ज्यन्ते अपस्युवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghirasta inda ojasā marmṛjyante apasyuvaḥ |
Translation: 7 Songs, Indu, active in their might are beautified for thee, wherewith

Sanskit Text: याभिर्मदाय शुम्भसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhirmadāya śumbhase ||
Translation: Thou deckest thee for our delight.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा मदाय घर्ष्वय उ लोकक्र्त्नुमीमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā madāya ghṛṣvaya u lokakṛtnumīmahe |
Translation: 8 To thee who givest ample room we pray, to win the joyous draught:

Sanskit Text: तव परशस्तयो महीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava praśastayo mahīḥ ||
Translation: Great are the praise& due to thee.

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यमिन्दविन्द्रयुर्मध्वः पवस्व धारया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyamindavindrayurmadhvaḥ pavasva dhārayā |
Translation: 9 Indu as, Indra's Friend, on us pour with a stream of sweetness, like

Sanskit Text: पर्जन्यो वर्ष्टिमानिव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parjanyo vṛṣṭimāniva ||
Translation: Parjanya sender of the rain.

Sanskit Text: गोषा इन्दो नर्षा अस्यश्वसा वाजसा उत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghoṣā indo nṛṣā asyaśvasā vājasā uta |
Translation: 10 Winner of kine, Indu, art thou, winner of heroes, steeds, and strength

Sanskit Text: आत्मा यज्ञस्य पूर्व्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ātmā yajñasya pūrvyaḥ ||
Translation: Primeval Soul of sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: एष देवो अमर्त्यः पर्णवीरिव दीयति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa devo amartyaḥ parṇavīriva dīyati |
Translation: 1. HERE present this Immortal God flies, like a bird upon her wings,

Sanskit Text: अभि दरोणान्यासदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi droṇānyāsadam ||
Translation: To settle in the vats of wood.

Sanskit Text: एष देवो विपा कर्तो.अति हवरांसि धावति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa devo vipā kṛto.ati hvarāṃsi dhāvati |
Translation: 2 This God, made ready with the hymn, runs swiftly through the winding ways,

Sanskit Text: पवमानो अदाभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamāno adābhyaḥ ||
Translation: Inviolable as he flows.

Sanskit Text: एष देवो विपन्युभिः पवमान रतायुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa devo vipanyubhiḥ pavamāna ṛtāyubhiḥ |
Translation: 3 This God while flowing is adorned, like a bay steed for war, by men

Sanskit Text: हरिर्वाजाय मर्ज्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: harirvājāya mṛjyate ||
Translation: Devout and skilled in holy songs.

Sanskit Text: एष विश्वानि वार्या शूरो यन्निव सत्वभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa viśvāni vāryā śūro yanniva satvabhiḥ |
Translation: 4 He, like a warrior going forth with heroes, as he flows along

Sanskit Text: पवमानःसिषासति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamānaḥsiṣāsati ||
Translation: Is fain to win all precious boons.

Sanskit Text: एष देवो रथर्यति पवमानो दशस्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa devo ratharyati pavamāno daśasyati |
Translation: 5 This God, as he is flowing on, speeds like a car and gives his gifts:

Sanskit Text: आविष कर्णोति वग्वनुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āviṣ kṛṇoti vaghvanum ||
Translation: He lets his voice be heard of all

Sanskit Text: एष विप्रैरभिष्टुतो.अपो देवो वि गाहते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa viprairabhiṣṭuto.apo devo vi ghāhate |
Translation: 6 Praised by the sacred bards, this God dives into waters, and bestows

Sanskit Text: दधद रत्नानिदाशुषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhad ratnānidāśuṣe ||
Translation: Rich gifts upon the worshipper.

Sanskit Text: एष दिवं वि धावति तिरो रजांसि धारया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa divaṃ vi dhāvati tiro rajāṃsi dhārayā |
Translation: 7 Away he rushes with his stream, across the regions, into heaven,

Sanskit Text: पवमानःकनिक्रदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamānaḥkanikradat ||
Translation: And roars as he is flowing on.

Sanskit Text: एष दिवं वयासरत तिरो रजाण्स्यस्प्र्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa divaṃ vyāsarat tiro rajāṇsyaspṛtaḥ |
Translation: 8 While flowing, meet for sacrifice, he hath gone up to heaven across

Sanskit Text: पवमानः सवध्वरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamānaḥ svadhvaraḥ ||
Translation: The regions, irresistible.

Sanskit Text: एष परत्नेन जन्मना देवो देवेभ्यः सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa pratnena janmanā devo devebhyaḥ sutaḥ |
Translation: 9 After the 'way of ancient time, this God, pressed out for Deities,

Sanskit Text: हरिः पवित्रेर्षति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hariḥ pavitrearṣati ||
Translation: Flows tawny to the straining-cloth.

Sanskit Text: एष उ सय पुरुव्रतो जज्ञानो जनयन्निषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa u sya puruvrato jajñāno janayanniṣaḥ |
Translation: 10 This Lord of many Holy Laws, even at his birth engendering strength,

Sanskit Text: धारया पवते सुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhārayā pavate sutaḥ ||
Translation: Effused, flows onward in a stream.

Sanskit Text: सना च सोम जेषि च पवमान महि शरवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanā ca soma jeṣi ca pavamāna mahi śravaḥ |
Translation: 1. O Soma flowing on thy way, win thou and conquer high renown;

Sanskit Text: अथा नो वस्यसस कर्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā no vasyasas kṛdhi ||
Translation: And make us better than we are.

Sanskit Text: सना जयोतिः सना सवर्विश्वा च सोम सौभगा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanā jyotiḥ sanā svarviśvā ca soma saubhaghā |
Translation: 2 Win thou the light, win heavenly light, and, Soma, all felicities;

Sanskrit Transliteration: athā ... ||
Translation: And make us better than we are.

Sanskit Text: सना दक्षमुत करतुमप सोम मर्धो जहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanā dakṣamuta kratumapa soma mṛdho jahi |
Translation: 3 Win skilful strength and mental power. O Soma, drive away our foes;

Sanskrit Transliteration: athā ... ||
Translation: And make us better than we are.

Sanskit Text: पवीतारः पुनीतन सोममिन्द्राय पातवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavītāraḥ punītana somamindrāya pātave |
Translation: 4 Ye purifiers, purify Soma for Indra, for his drink:

Sanskrit Transliteration: athā ... ||
Translation: Make thou us better than we are.

Sanskit Text: तवं सूर्ये न आ भज तव करत्वा तवोतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ sūrye na ā bhaja tava kratvā tavotibhiḥ |
Translation: 5 Give us our portion in the Sun through thine own mental power and aids;

Sanskrit Transliteration: athā ... ||
Translation: And make us better than we are.

Sanskit Text: तव करत्वा तवोतिभिर्ज्योक पश्येम सूर्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava kratvā tavotibhirjyok paśyema sūryam |
Translation: 6 Through thine own mental power and aid long may we look upon the Sun;

Sanskrit Transliteration: athā ... ||
Translation: Make thou us better than we are.

Sanskit Text: अभ्यर्ष सवायुध सोम दविबर्हसं रयिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhyarṣa svāyudha soma dvibarhasaṃ rayim |
Translation: 7 Well-weaponed Soma, pour to usa stream of riches doubly great;

Sanskrit Transliteration: athā ... ||
Translation: And make us better than we are.

Sanskit Text: अभ्यर्षानपच्युतो रयिं समत्सु सासहिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhyarṣānapacyuto rayiṃ samatsu sāsahiḥ |
Translation: 8 As one victorious unsubdued in battle pour forth wealth to us;

Sanskrit Transliteration: athā ... ||
Translation: And make us better than we are.

Sanskit Text: तवां यज्ञैरवीव्र्धन पवमान विधर्मणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ yajñairavīvṛdhan pavamāna vidharmaṇi |
Translation: 9 By worship, Pavamana! men have strengthened thee to prop the Law:

Sanskrit Transliteration: athā ... ||
Translation: Make thou us better than we are.

Sanskit Text: रयिं नश्चित्रमश्विनमिन्दो विश्वायमा भर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rayiṃ naścitramaśvinamindo viśvāyamā bhara |
Translation: 10 O Indu, bring us wealth in steeds, manifold. quickening all life;

Sanskrit Transliteration: athā .. . ||
Translation: And mate us better than we are.

Sanskit Text: समिद्धो विश्वतस पतिः पवमानो वि राजति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samiddho viśvatas patiḥ pavamāno vi rājati |
Translation: 1. ENKINDLED, Pavamana, Lord, sends forth his light on, every side

Sanskit Text: परीणन वर्षा कनिक्रदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prīṇan vṛṣā kanikradat ||
Translation: In friendly show, the bellowing Bull.

Sanskit Text: तनूनपात पवमानः शर्ङगे शिशानो अर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tanūnapāt pavamānaḥ śṛṅghe śiśāno arṣati |
Translation: 2 He, Pavamana, Self-produced, speeds onward sharpening his horns:

Sanskit Text: अन्तरिक्षेण रारजत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: antarikṣeṇa rārajat ||
Translation: He glitters through the firmament.

Sanskit Text: ईळेन्यः पवमानो रयिर्वि राजति दयुमान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īḷenyaḥ pavamāno rayirvi rājati dyumān |
Translation: 3 Brilliant like wealth, adorable, with splendour Pavamana shines,

Sanskit Text: मधोर्धाराभिरोजसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhordhārābhirojasā ||
Translation: Mightily with the streams of meath.

Sanskit Text: बर्हिः पराचीनमोजसा पवमान सत्र्णन हरिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: barhiḥ prācīnamojasā pavamāna stṛṇan hariḥ |
Translation: 4 The tawny Pavamana, who strews from of old the grass with might,

Sanskit Text: देवेषु देव ईयते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: deveṣu deva īyate ||
Translation: Is worshipped, God amid the Gods.

Sanskit Text: उदातैर्जिहते बर्हद दवारो देवीर्हिरण्ययीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udātairjihate bṛhad dvāro devīrhiraṇyayīḥ |
Translation: 5 The golden, the Celestial Doors are lifted with their frames on high,

Sanskit Text: पवमानेन सुष्टुताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamānena suṣṭutāḥ ||
Translation: By Pavamana glorified.

Sanskit Text: सुशिल्पे बर्हती मही पवमानो वर्षण्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suśilpe bṛhatī mahī pavamāno vṛṣaṇyati |
Translation: 6 With passion Pavamana longs for the great lofty pair, well-formed

Sanskit Text: नक्तोषासा नदर्शते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: naktoṣāsā nadarśate ||
Translation: Like beauteous maidens, Night and Dawn
