Sanskit Text: उभा देवा नर्चक्षसा होतारा दैव्या हुवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhā devā nṛcakṣasā hotārā daivyā huve |
Translation: 7 Both Gods who look on men I call, Celestial Heralds: Indra's Self

Sanskit Text: पवमान इन्द्रोव्र्षा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamāna indrovṛṣā ||
Translation: Is Pavamana, yea, the Bull.

Sanskit Text: भारती पवमानस्य सरस्वतीळा मही |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhāratī pavamānasya sarasvatīḷā mahī |
Translation: 8 This, Pavamana's sacrifice, shall the three beauteous Goddesses,

Sanskit Text: इमं नो यज्ञमा गमन तिस्रो देवीः सुपेशसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ no yajñamā ghaman tisro devīḥ supeśasaḥ ||
Translation: Sarasvatī and Bhāratī and Iḷā, Mighty One, attend.

Sanskit Text: तवष्टारमग्रजां गोपां पुरोयावानमा हुवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṣṭāramaghrajāṃ ghopāṃ puroyāvānamā huve |
Translation: 9 1 summon Tvaṣṭar hither, our protector, champion, earliest-born,

Sanskit Text: इन्दुरिन्द्रो वर्षा हरिः पवमानः परजापतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indurindro vṛṣā hariḥ pavamānaḥ prajāpatiḥ ||
Translation: Indu is Indra, tawny Steer; Pavamana is Prajāpati.

Sanskit Text: वनस्पतिं पवमान मध्वा समङगधि धारया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanaspatiṃ pavamāna madhvā samaṅghdhi dhārayā |
Translation: 10 O Pavamana, with the meath in streams anoint Vanaspati,

Sanskit Text: सहस्रवल्शं हरितं भराजमानं हिरण्ययम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasravalśaṃ haritaṃ bhrājamānaṃ hiraṇyayam ||
Translation: The ever-green. the golden-hued, refulgent, with a thousand boughs.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवाः सवाहाक्र्तिं पवमानस्या गत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devāḥ svāhākṛtiṃ pavamānasyā ghata |
Translation: 11 Come to the consecrating rite of Pavamana, all ye Gods,—

Sanskit Text: वायुर्ब्र्हस्पतिः सूर्यो.अग्निरिन्द्रः सजोषसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāyurbṛhaspatiḥ sūryo.aghnirindraḥ sajoṣasaḥ ||
Translation: Vāyu, Sūrya, Bṛhaspati, Indra, and Agni, in accord.

Sanskit Text: मन्द्रया सोम धारया वर्षा पवस्व देवयुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mandrayā soma dhārayā vṛṣā pavasva devayuḥ |
Translation: 1. SOMA, flow on with pleasant stream, a Bull devoted to the Gods,

Sanskit Text: अव्यो वारेष्वस्मयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avyo vāreṣvasmayuḥ ||
Translation: Our Friend, unto the woollen sieve.

Sanskit Text: अभि तयं मद्यं मदमिन्दविन्द्र इति कषर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tyaṃ madyaṃ madamindavindra iti kṣara |
Translation: 2 Pour hitherward, as Indra's Self, Indu, that gladdening stream of thine,

Sanskit Text: अभि वाजिनोर्वतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi vājinoarvataḥ ||
Translation: And send us coursers full of strength.

Sanskit Text: अभि तयं पूर्व्यं मदं सुवानो अर्ष पवित्र आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tyaṃ pūrvyaṃ madaṃ suvāno arṣa pavitra ā |
Translation: 3 Flow to the filter hitherward, pouring that ancient gladdening juice,

Sanskit Text: अभि वाजमुत शरवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi vājamuta śravaḥ ||
Translation: Streaming forth power and high renown.

Sanskit Text: अनु दरप्सास इन्दव आपो न परवतासरन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu drapsāsa indava āpo na pravatāsaran |
Translation: 4 Hither the sparkling drops have flowed, like waters down a steep descent

Sanskit Text: पुनाना इन्द्रमाशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punānā indramāśata ||
Translation: They have reached Indra purified.

Sanskit Text: यमत्यमिव वाजिनं मर्जन्ति योषणो दश |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamatyamiva vājinaṃ mṛjanti yoṣaṇo daśa |
Translation: 5 Whom, having passed the filter, ten dames cleanse, as ’twere a vigorous steed,

Sanskit Text: वने करीळन्तमत्यविम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vane krīḷantamatyavim ||
Translation: While he disports him in the wood,—

Sanskit Text: तं गोभिर्व्र्षणं रसं मदाय देववीतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ ghobhirvṛṣaṇaṃ rasaṃ madāya devavītaye |
Translation: 6 The steer-strong juice with milk pour forth, for feast and service of the Gods,

Sanskit Text: सुतं भराय सं सर्ज ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sutaṃ bharāya saṃ sṛja ||
Translation: To him who bears away the draught.

Sanskit Text: देवो देवाय धारयेन्द्राय पवते सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devo devāya dhārayendrāya pavate sutaḥ |
Translation: 7. Effused, the God flows onward with his stream to Indra, to the God,

Sanskit Text: पयो यदस्य पीपयत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: payo yadasya pīpayat ||
Translation: So that his milk may strengthen him.

Sanskit Text: आत्मा यज्ञस्य रंह्या सुष्वाणः पवते सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ātmā yajñasya raṃhyā suṣvāṇaḥ pavate sutaḥ |
Translation: 8 Soul of the sacrifice, the juice effused flows quickly on: he keeps

Sanskit Text: परत्नंनि पाति काव्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratnaṃni pāti kāvyam ||
Translation: His ancient wisdom of a Sage.

Sanskit Text: एवा पुनान इन्द्रयुर्मदं मदिष्ठ वीतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā punāna indrayurmadaṃ madiṣṭha vītaye |
Translation: 9 So pouring forth, as Indra's Friend, strong drink, best Gladdener! for the feast,

Sanskit Text: गुहा चिद दधिषे गिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghuhā cid dadhiṣe ghiraḥ ||
Translation: Thou, even in secret, storest hymns.

Sanskit Text: अस्र्ग्रम इन्दवः पथा धर्मन्न रतस्य सुश्रियः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asṛghram indavaḥ pathā dharmann ṛtasya suśriyaḥ |
Translation: 1. FORTH on their way the glorious drops have flowed for maintenance of Law,

Sanskit Text: विदाना अस्य योजनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidānā asya yojanam ||
Translation: Knowing this sacrifice's course.

Sanskit Text: पर धारा मध्वो अग्रियो महीर अपो वि गाहते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra dhārā madhvo aghriyo mahīr apo vi ghāhate |
Translation: 2 Down in the mighty waters sinks the stream of meath, most excellent,

Sanskit Text: हविर हविष्षु वन्द्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: havir haviṣṣu vandyaḥ ||
Translation: Oblation best of all in worth.

Sanskit Text: पर युजो वाचो अग्रियो वर्षाव चक्रदद वने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yujo vāco aghriyo vṛṣāva cakradad vane |
Translation: 3 About the holy place, the Steer true, guileless, noblest, hath sent forth

Sanskit Text: सद्माभि सत्यो अध्वरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadmābhi satyo adhvaraḥ ||
Translation: Continuous voices in the wood.

Sanskit Text: परि यत काव्या कविर नर्म्णा वसानो अर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari yat kāvyā kavir nṛmṇā vasāno arṣati |
Translation: 4 When, clothed in manly strength, the Sage flows in celestial wisdom round,

Sanskit Text: सवर वाजी सिषासति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svar vājī siṣāsati ||
Translation: The Strong would win the light of heaven.

Sanskit Text: पवमानो अभि सप्र्धो विशो राजेव सीदति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamāno abhi spṛdho viśo rājeva sīdati |
Translation: 5 When purified, he sits as King above the hosts, among his folk,

Sanskit Text: यद ईम रण्वन्ति वेधसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad īm ṛṇvanti vedhasaḥ ||
Translation: What time the sages bring him nigh.

Sanskit Text: अव्यो वारे परि परियो हरिर वनेषु सीदति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avyo vāre pari priyo harir vaneṣu sīdati |
Translation: 6 Dear, golden-coloured, in the fleece he sinks and settles in the wood:

Sanskit Text: रेभो वनुष्यते मती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rebho vanuṣyate matī ||
Translation: The Singer shows his zeal in hymns.

Sanskit Text: स वायुम इन्द्रम अश्विना साकम मदेन गछति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vāyum indram aśvinā sākam madena ghachati |
Translation: 7 He goes to Indra, Vāyu, to the Aśvins, as his custom is,

Sanskit Text: रणा यो अस्य धर्मभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: raṇā yo asya dharmabhiḥ ||
Translation: With gladdening juice which gives them joy.

Sanskit Text: आ मित्रावरुणा भगम मध्वः पवन्त ऊर्मयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā mitrāvaruṇā bhagham madhvaḥ pavanta ūrmayaḥ |
Translation: 8 Tle streams of pleasant Soma flow to Bhaga, Mitra-Varuṇa,—

Sanskit Text: विदाना अस्य शक्मभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidānā asya śakmabhiḥ ||
Translation: Well-knowing through his mighty powers.

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं रोदसी रयिम मध्वो वाजस्य सातये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ rodasī rayim madhvo vājasya sātaye |
Translation: Heaven and Earth, riches of meath to win us wealth:

Sanskit Text: शरवो वसूनि सं जितम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śravo vasūni saṃ jitam ||
Translation: Gain for us treasures and renown.

Sanskit Text: एते सोमा अभि परियम इन्द्रस्य कामम अक्षरन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete somā abhi priyam indrasya kāmam akṣaran |
Translation: 1. OBEYING Indra's dear desire these Soma juices have flowed forth,

Sanskit Text: वर्धन्तो अस्य वीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vardhanto asya vīryam ||
Translation: Increasing his heroic might.

Sanskit Text: पुनानासश चमूषदो गछन्तो वायुम अश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: punānāsaś camūṣado ghachanto vāyum aśvinā |
Translation: 2 Laid in the bowl, pure-flowing on to Vāyu and the Aśvins, may

Sanskit Text: ते नो धान्तु सुवीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te no dhāntu suvīryam ||
Translation: These give us great heroic strength.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य सोम राधसे पुनानो हार्दि चोदय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya soma rādhase punāno hārdi codaya |
Translation: 3 Soma, as thou art purified, incite to bounty Indra's heart,

Sanskit Text: रतस्य योनिम आसदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya yonim āsadam ||
Translation: To sit in place of sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: मर्जन्ति तवा दश कषिपो हिन्वन्ति सप्त धीतयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mṛjanti tvā daśa kṣipo hinvanti sapta dhītayaḥ |
Translation: 4 The ten swift fingers deck thee forth, seven ministers impel thee on:

Sanskit Text: अनु विप्रा अमादिषुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu viprā amādiṣuḥ ||
Translation: The sages have rejoiced in thee.

Sanskit Text: देवेभ्यस तवा मदाय कं सर्जानम अति मेष्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devebhyas tvā madāya kaṃ sṛjānam ati meṣyaḥ |
Translation: 5 When through the filter thou art poured, we clothe thee with a robe of milk

Sanskit Text: सं गोभिर वासयामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ ghobhir vāsayāmasi ||
Translation: To be a gladdening draught for Gods.

Sanskit Text: पुनानः कलशेष्व आ वस्त्राण्य अरुषो हरिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: punānaḥ kalaśeṣv ā vastrāṇy aruṣo hariḥ |
Translation: 6 When purified within the jars, Soma, brightred and golden-hued,

Sanskit Text: परि गव्यान्य अव्यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari ghavyāny avyata ||
Translation: Hath clothed him with a robe of milk.

Sanskit Text: मघोन आ पवस्व नो जहि विश्वा अप दविषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: maghona ā pavasva no jahi viśvā apa dviṣaḥ |
Translation: 7 Flow on to us and make us rich. Drive all our enemies away.

Sanskit Text: इन्दो सखायम आ विश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indo sakhāyam ā viśa ||
Translation: O Indu, flow into thy Friend.

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्टिं दिवः परि सरव दयुम्नम पर्थिव्या अधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṭiṃ divaḥ pari srava dyumnam pṛthivyā adhi |
Translation: Send down the rain from heaven, a stream of opulence from earth. Give us,

Sanskit Text: सहो नः सोम पर्त्सु धाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saho naḥ soma pṛtsu dhāḥ ||
Translation: O Soma, victory in war.

Sanskit Text: नर्चक्षसं तवा वयम इन्द्रपीतं सवर्विदम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛcakṣasaṃ tvā vayam indrapītaṃ svarvidam |
Translation: 9 May we obtain thee, Indra's drink, who viewest men and findest light,

Sanskit Text: भक्षीमहि परजाम इषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhakṣīmahi prajām iṣam ||
Translation: Gain thee, and progeny and food.

Sanskit Text: परि परिया दिवः कविर वयांसि नप्त्य्र हितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari priyā divaḥ kavir vayāṃsi naptyr hitaḥ |
Translation: 1. THE Sage of Heaven whose heart is wise, when laid between both hands and pressed,

Sanskit Text: सुवानो याति कविक्रतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvāno yāti kavikratuḥ ||
Translation: Sends us delightful powers of life.

Sanskit Text: पर-पर कषयाय पन्यसे जनाय जुष्टो अद्रुहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra-pra kṣayāya panyase janāya juṣṭo adruhe |
Translation: 2 On, onward to a glorious home; dear to the people void of guile,

Sanskit Text: वीत्य अर्ष चनिष्ठया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vīty arṣa caniṣṭhayā ||
Translation: With excellent enjoyment, flow.

Sanskit Text: स सूनुर मातरा शुचिर जातो जाते अरोचयत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sūnur mātarā śucir jāto jāte arocayat |
Translation: 3 He, the bright Son, when born illumed his Parents who had sprung to life,

Sanskit Text: महान मही रताव्र्धा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahān mahī ṛtāvṛdhā ||
Translation: Great Son great Strengtheners of Law.

Sanskit Text: स सप्त धीतिभिर हितो नद्य अजिन्वद अद्रुहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sapta dhītibhir hito nady ajinvad adruhaḥ |
Translation: 4 Urged by the seven devotions he hath stirred the guileless rivers which

Sanskit Text: या एकम अक्षि वाव्र्धुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā ekam akṣi vāvṛdhuḥ ||
Translation: Have magnified the Single Eye.

Sanskit Text: ता अभि सन्तम अस्त्र्तम महे युवानम आ दधुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā abhi santam astṛtam mahe yuvānam ā dadhuḥ |
Translation: 5 These helped to might theYouthful One, high over all, invincible,

Sanskit Text: इन्दुम इन्द्र तव वरते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indum indra tava vrate ||
Translation: Even Indu, Indra! in thy law.

Sanskit Text: अभि वह्निर अमर्त्यः सप्त पश्यति वावहिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi vahnir amartyaḥ sapta paśyati vāvahiḥ |
Translation: 6 The immortal Courser, good to draw, looks down upon the Seven: the fount

Sanskit Text: करिविर देवीर अतर्पयत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: krivir devīr atarpayat ||
Translation: Hath satisfied the Goddesses

Sanskit Text: अवा कल्पेषु नः पुमस तमांसि सोम योध्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avā kalpeṣu naḥ pumas tamāṃsi soma yodhyā |
Translation: 7 Aid us in holy rites, O Man: O Pavamana, drive away

Sanskit Text: तानि पुनान जघनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāni punāna jaghanaḥ ||
Translation: Dark shades that must be met in fight.

Sanskit Text: नू नव्यसे नवीयसे सूक्ताय साधया पथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū navyase navīyase sūktāya sādhayā pathaḥ |
Translation: 8 Make the paths ready for a hymn newer and newer evermore:

Sanskit Text: परत्नवद रोचया रुचः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratnavad rocayā rucaḥ ||
Translation: Make the lights shine as erst they shone.

Sanskit Text: पवमान महि शरवो गाम अश्वं रासि वीरवत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamāna mahi śravo ghām aśvaṃ rāsi vīravat |
Translation: 9 Give, Pavamana, high renown, give kine and steeds and hero sons:

Sanskit Text: सना मेधां सना सवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanā medhāṃ sanā svaḥ |
Translation: Win for us wisdom, win the light.

Sanskit Text: पर सवानासो रथा इवार्वन्तो न शरवस्यवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra svānāso rathā ivārvanto na śravasyavaḥ |
Translation: 1. LIKE cars that thunder on their way, like coursers eager for renown,

Sanskit Text: सोमासो राये अक्रमुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somāso rāye akramuḥ ||
Translation: Have Soma-drops flowed forth for wealth.

Sanskit Text: हिन्वानासो रथा इव दधन्विरे गभस्त्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hinvānāso rathā iva dadhanvire ghabhastyoḥ |
Translation: 2 Forth have they rushed from holding hands, like chariots that are urged to speed,

Sanskit Text: भरासः कारिणाम इव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharāsaḥ kāriṇām iva ||
Translation: Like joyful songs of singing-men.

Sanskit Text: राजानो न परशस्तिभिः सोमासो गोभिर अञ्जते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājāno na praśastibhiḥ somāso ghobhir añjate |
Translation: 3 The Somas deck themselves with milk, as Kings are graced with eulogies,

Sanskit Text: यज्ञो न सप्त धात्र्भिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajño na sapta dhātṛbhiḥ ||
Translation: And, with seven priests, the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: परि सुवानास इन्दवो मदाय बर्हणा गिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari suvānāsa indavo madāya barhaṇā ghirā |
Translation: 4 Pressed for the gladdening draught, the drops flow forth abundantly with song,

Sanskit Text: सुता अर्षन्ति धारया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sutā arṣanti dhārayā ||
Translation: The Soma juices in a stream.

Sanskit Text: आपानासो विवस्वतो जनन्त उषसो भगम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpānāso vivasvato jananta uṣaso bhagham |
Translation: 5 Winning Vivasvān's glory and producing Morning's light, the Suns

Sanskit Text: सूरा अण्वं वि तन्वते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūrā aṇvaṃ vi tanvate ||
Translation: Pass through the openings of the cloth.

Sanskit Text: अप दवारा मतीनाम परत्ना रण्वन्ति कारवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa dvārā matīnām pratnā ṛṇvanti kāravaḥ |
Translation: 6 The singing-men of ancient time open the doors of sacred songs,—

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्णो हरस आयवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṇo harasa āyavaḥ ||
Translation: Men, for the mighty to accept.

Sanskit Text: समीचीनास आसते होतारः सप्तजामयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samīcīnāsa āsate hotāraḥ saptajāmayaḥ |
Translation: 7 Combined in close society sit the seven priests, the brother-hood,

Sanskit Text: पदम एकस्य पिप्रतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: padam ekasya piprataḥ ||
Translation: Filling the station of the One.

Sanskit Text: नाभा नाभिं न आ ददे चक्षुश चित सूर्ये सचा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nābhā nābhiṃ na ā dade cakṣuś cit sūrye sacā |
Translation: 8 He gives us kinship with the Gods, and with the Sun unites our eye:

Sanskit Text: कवेर अपत्यम आ दुहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaver apatyam ā duhe ||
Translation: The Sage's ofrspring hath appeared.

Sanskit Text: अभि परिया दिवस पदम अध्वर्युभिर गुहा हितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi priyā divas padam adhvaryubhir ghuhā hitam |
Translation: 9 The Sun with his dear eye beholds that quarter of the heavens which priests

Sanskit Text: सूरः पश्यति चक्षसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūraḥ paśyati cakṣasā ||
Translation: Have placed within the sacred cell.

Sanskit Text: सोमः पुनानो अर्षति सहस्रधारो अत्यविः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaḥ punāno arṣati sahasradhāro atyaviḥ |
Translation: 1. PASSED through, the fleece in thousand streams the Soma, purified, flows on

Sanskit Text: वायोरिन्द्रस्यनिष्क्र्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāyorindrasyaniṣkṛtam ||
Translation: To Indra's, Viyu's special place.

Sanskit Text: पवमानमवस्यवो विप्रमभि पर गायत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamānamavasyavo vipramabhi pra ghāyata |
Translation: 2 Sing forth, ye men who long for help, to Pavamana, to the Sage,

Sanskit Text: सुष्वाणं देववीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suṣvāṇaṃ devavītaye ||
Translation: Effused to entertain the Gods.

Sanskit Text: पवन्ते वाजसातये सोमाः सहस्रपाजसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavante vājasātaye somāḥ sahasrapājasaḥ |
Translation: 3 The Soma-drops with thousand powers are purified for victory,

Sanskit Text: गर्णाना देववीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛṇānā devavītaye ||
Translation: Hymned to become the feast of Gods.

Sanskit Text: उत नो वाजसातये पवस्व बर्हतीरिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta no vājasātaye pavasva bṛhatīriṣaḥ |
Translation: 4 Yea, as thou flowest bring great store of food that we may win the spoil

Sanskit Text: दयुमदिन्दो सुवीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyumadindo suvīryam ||
Translation: Indu, bring splendid manly might.

Sanskit Text: ते नः सहस्रिणं रयिं पवन्तामा सुवीर्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te naḥ sahasriṇaṃ rayiṃ pavantāmā suvīryam |
Translation: 5 May they in flowing give us wealth in thousands, and heroic power,—

Sanskit Text: सुवाना देवास इन्दवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvānā devāsa indavaḥ ||
Translation: These Godlike Soma-drops effused.

Sanskit Text: अत्या हियाना न हेत्र्भिरस्र्ग्रं वाजसातये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atyā hiyānā na hetṛbhirasṛghraṃ vājasātaye |
Translation: 6 Like coursers by their drivers urged, they were poured forth, for victory,

Sanskit Text: वि वारमव्यमाशवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi vāramavyamāśavaḥ ||
Translation: Swift through the woollen straining-cloth.

Sanskit Text: वाश्रा अर्षन्तीन्दवो.अभि वत्सं न धेनवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāśrā arṣantīndavo.abhi vatsaṃ na dhenavaḥ |
Translation: 7 Noisily flow the Soma-drops, like milch-kine lowing to their calves:

Sanskit Text: दधन्विरेगभस्त्योः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhanvireghabhastyoḥ ||
Translation: They have run forth from both the hands.

Sanskit Text: जुष्ट इन्द्राय मत्सरः पवमान कनिक्रदत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣṭa indrāya matsaraḥ pavamāna kanikradat |
Translation: 8 As Gladdener whom Indra loves, O Pavamana, with a roar

Sanskit Text: विश्वा अप दविषो जहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā apa dviṣo jahi ||
Translation: Drive all our enemies away.

Sanskit Text: अपघ्नन्तो अराव्णः पवमानाः सवर्द्र्शः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apaghnanto arāvṇaḥ pavamānāḥ svardṛśaḥ |
Translation: 9 O Pavamamas, driving off the godless, looking on the light,

Sanskit Text: योनाव रतस्य सीदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yonāv ṛtasya sīdata ||
Translation: Sit in the place of sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: परि परासिष्यदत कविः सिन्धोरूर्मावधि शरितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari prāsiṣyadat kaviḥ sindhorūrmāvadhi śritaḥ |
Translation: 1. REPOSING on the river's wave the Sage hath widely flowed around,

Sanskit Text: कारं बिभ्रत पुरुस्प्र्हम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kāraṃ bibhrat puruspṛham ||
Translation: Bearing the hymn which many love.

Sanskit Text: गिरा यदी सबन्धवः पञ्च वराता अपस्यवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghirā yadī sabandhavaḥ pañca vrātā apasyavaḥ |
Translation: 2 When the Five kindred Companies, active in duty, with the song

Sanskit Text: परिष्क्र्ण्वन्ति धर्णसिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pariṣkṛṇvanti dharṇasim ||
Translation: Establish him, the Powerful,

Sanskit Text: आदस्य शुष्मिणो रसे विश्वे देवा अमत्सत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādasya śuṣmiṇo rase viśve devā amatsata |
Translation: 3 Then in his juice whose strength is great, have all the Gods rejoiced themselves,

Sanskit Text: यदी गोभिर्वसायते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadī ghobhirvasāyate ||
Translation: When he hath clothed him in the milk.

Sanskit Text: निरिणानो वि धावति जहच्छर्याणि तान्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: niriṇāno vi dhāvati jahaccharyāṇi tānvā |
Translation: 4 Freeing himself he flows away, leaving his body's severed limbs,

Sanskit Text: अत्रा सं जिघ्नते युजा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrā saṃ jighnate yujā ||
Translation: And meets his own Companion here.

Sanskit Text: नप्तीभिर्यो विवस्वतः शुभ्रो न माम्र्जे युवा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: naptībhiryo vivasvataḥ śubhro na māmṛje yuvā |
Translation: 5 He by the daughters of the priest, like a fair youth, hath been adorned,

Sanskit Text: गाः कर्ण्वानो न निर्णिजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāḥ kṛṇvāno na nirṇijam ||
Translation: Making the milk, as ’twere, his robe.

Sanskit Text: अति शरिती तिरश्चता गव्या जिगात्यण्व्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ati śritī tiraścatā ghavyā jighātyaṇvyā |
Translation: 6 O'er the fine fingers, through desire of milk, in winding course he goes,

Sanskit Text: वग्नुमियर्ति यं विदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaghnumiyarti yaṃ vide ||
Translation: And utters voice which he hath found.

Sanskit Text: अभि कषिपः समग्मत मर्जयन्तीरिषस पतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi kṣipaḥ samaghmata marjayantīriṣas patim |
Translation: 7 The nimble fingers have approached, adorning him the Lord of Strength:

Sanskit Text: पर्ष्ठा गर्भ्णत वाजिनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛṣṭhā ghṛbhṇata vājinaḥ ||
Translation: They grasp the vigorous Courser's back.

Sanskit Text: परि दिव्यानि मर्म्र्शद विश्वानि सोम पार्थिवा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari divyāni marmṛśad viśvāni soma pārthivā |
Translation: 8 Comprising all the treasures that are in the heavens and on the earth,

Sanskit Text: वसूनि याह्यस्मयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasūni yāhyasmayuḥ ||
Translation: Come, Soma, as our faithful Friend.

Sanskit Text: एष धिया यात्यण्व्य शूरो रथेभिराशुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa dhiyā yātyaṇvya śūro rathebhirāśubhiḥ |
Translation: 1. THROUGH the fine fingers, with the song, this Hero comes with rapid ears,

Sanskit Text: गछन्निन्द्रस्य निष्क्र्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghachannindrasya niṣkṛtam ||
Translation: Going to Indra's special place.

Sanskit Text: एष पुरू धियायते बर्हते देवतातये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa purū dhiyāyate bṛhate devatātaye |
Translation: 2 In holy thought he ponders much for the great worship of the Gods.

Sanskit Text: यत्राम्र्तास आसते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatrāmṛtāsa āsate ||
Translation: Where the Immortals have their seat.

Sanskit Text: एष हितो वि नीयते.अन्तः शुभ्रावता पथा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa hito vi nīyate.antaḥ śubhrāvatā pathā |
Translation: 3 Like a good horse is he led out, when on the path that shines with light

Sanskit Text: यदी तुञ्जन्ति भूर्णयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadī tuñjanti bhūrṇayaḥ ||
Translation: The mettled steeds exert their strength.

Sanskit Text: एष शर्ङगाणि दोधुवच्छिशीते यूथ्यो वर्षा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa śṛṅghāṇi dodhuvacchiśīte yūthyo vṛṣā |
Translation: 4 He brandishes his horns on high, and whets them Bull who leads the herd,

Sanskit Text: नर्म्णा दधान ओजसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛmṇā dadhāna ojasā ||
Translation: Doing with might heroic deeds.

Sanskit Text: एष रुक्मिभिरीयते वाजि शुभ्रेभिरंशुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa rukmibhirīyate vāji śubhrebhiraṃśubhiḥ |
Translation: 5 He moves, a vigorous Steed, adorned with beauteous rays of shining gold,

Sanskit Text: पतिः सिन्धूनां भवन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: patiḥ sindhūnāṃ bhavan ||
Translation: Becoming Sovran of the streams.

Sanskit Text: एष वसूनि पिब्दना परुषा ययिवानति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa vasūni pibdanā paruṣā yayivānati |
Translation: 6 He, over places rough to pass, bringing rich treasures closely packed.

Sanskit Text: अव शादेषु गछति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava śādeṣu ghachati ||
Translation: Descends into the reservoirs.

Sanskit Text: एतं मर्जन्ति मर्ज्यमुप दरोणेष्वायवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etaṃ mṛjanti marjyamupa droṇeṣvāyavaḥ |
Translation: 7 Men beautify him in the vats, him worthy to be beautified,

Sanskit Text: परचक्राणं महीरिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pracakrāṇaṃ mahīriṣaḥ ||
Translation: Him who brings forth abundant food.

Sanskit Text: एतमु तयं दश कषिपो मर्जन्ति सप्त धीतयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etamu tyaṃ daśa kṣipo mṛjanti sapta dhītayaḥ |
Translation: 8 Him, even him, the fingers ten and the seven songs make beautiful,

Sanskit Text: सवायुधं मदिन्तमम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāyudhaṃ madintamam ||
Translation: Well-weaponed, best of gladdeners.

Sanskit Text: पर ते सोतार ओण्यो रसं मदाय घर्ष्वय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te sotāra oṇyo rasaṃ madāya ghṛṣvaya |
Translation: 1. THE pressers from the Soma-press send forth thy juice for rapturous joy

Sanskit Text: सर्गो न तक्त्येतशः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sargho na taktyetaśaḥ ||
Translation: The speckled sap runs like a flood.

Sanskit Text: करत्वा दक्षस्य रथ्यमपो वसानमन्धसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratvā dakṣasya rathyamapo vasānamandhasā |
Translation: 2 With strength we follow through the sieve him who brings might and wins the kine,

Sanskit Text: गोषामण्वेषु सश्चिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghoṣāmaṇveṣu saścima ||
Translation: Enrobed in water with his juice.

Sanskit Text: अनप्तमप्सु दुष्टरं सोमं पवित्र आ सर्ज |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anaptamapsu duṣṭaraṃ somaṃ pavitra ā sṛja |
Translation: 3 Pour on the sieve the Soma, ne’er subdued in waters, waterless,

Sanskit Text: पुनीहीन्द्राय पातवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punīhīndrāya pātave ||
Translation: And make it pure for Indra's drink.

Sanskit Text: पर पुनानस्य चेतसा सोमः पवित्रे अर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra punānasya cetasā somaḥ pavitre arṣati |
Translation: 4 Moved by the purifier's thought, the Soma flows into the sieve:

Sanskit Text: करत्वा सधस्थमासदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratvā sadhasthamāsadat ||
Translation: By wisdom it hath gained its home.

Sanskit Text: पर तवा नमोभिरिन्दव इन्द्र सोमा अस्र्क्षत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra tvā namobhirindava indra somā asṛkṣata |
Translation: 5 With humble homage, Indra, have the Soma-drops flowed forth to thee,

Sanskit Text: महे भरायकारिणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahe bharāyakāriṇaḥ ||
Translation: Contending for the glorious prize.

Sanskit Text: पुनानो रूपे अव्यये विश्वा अर्षन्नभि शरियः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: punāno rūpe avyaye viśvā arṣannabhi śriyaḥ |
Translation: 6 Purified in his fleecy garb, attaining every beauty, he

Sanskit Text: शूरो न गोषु तिष्ठति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śūro na ghoṣu tiṣṭhati ||
Translation: Stands, hero-like, amid the kine.

Sanskit Text: दिवो न सानु पिप्युषी धारा सुतस्य वेधसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo na sānu pipyuṣī dhārā sutasya vedhasaḥ |
Translation: 7 Swelling, as ’twere, to heights of heaven, the stream of the creative juice

Sanskit Text: वर्था पवित्रे अर्षति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛthā pavitre arṣati ||
Translation: Falls lightly on the cleansing sieve.

Sanskit Text: तवं सोम विपश्चितं तना पुनान आयुषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ soma vipaścitaṃ tanā punāna āyuṣu |
Translation: 8 Thus, Soma, purifying himwho knoweth song mid living men,

Sanskit Text: अव्यो वारं वि धावसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avyo vāraṃ vi dhāvasi ||
Translation: Thou wanderest through the cloth of wool.

Sanskit Text: पर निम्नेनेव सिन्धवो घनन्तो वर्त्राणि भूर्णयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra nimneneva sindhavo ghnanto vṛtrāṇi bhūrṇayaḥ |
Translation: 1. LIKE rivers down a steep descent, slaying the Vṛtras, full of zeal,

Sanskit Text: सोमा अस्र्ग्रमाशवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somā asṛghramāśavaḥ ||
Translation: The rapid Soma-streams have flowed.

Sanskit Text: अभि सुवानास इन्दवो वर्ष्टयः पर्थिवीमिव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi suvānāsa indavo vṛṣṭayaḥ pṛthivīmiva |
Translation: 2 The drops of Soma juice effused fall like the rain upon the earth:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं सोमासो अक्षरन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ somāso akṣaran ||
Translation: To Indra flow the Soma-streams.

Sanskit Text: अत्यूर्मिर्मत्सरो मदः सोमः पवित्रे अर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atyūrmirmatsaro madaḥ somaḥ pavitre arṣati |
Translation: 3 With swelling wave the gladdening drink, the Soma, flows intoṭhe sieve,

Sanskit Text: विघ्नन रक्षांसि देवयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vighnan rakṣāṃsi devayuḥ ||
Translation: Loving the Gods and slaying fiends.

Sanskit Text: आ कलशेषु धावति पवित्रे परि षिच्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā kalaśeṣu dhāvati pavitre pari ṣicyate |
Translation: 4 It hastens to the pitchers, poured upon the sieve it waxes strong

Sanskit Text: उक्थैर्यज्ञेषुवर्धते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukthairyajñeṣuvardhate ||
Translation: At sacrifices through the lauds.

Sanskit Text: अति तरी सोम रोचना रोहन न भराजसे दिवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ati trī soma rocanā rohan na bhrājase divam |
Translation: 5 Soma, thou shinest mounting heaven as ’twere above light's triple realm,

Sanskit Text: इष्णन सूर्यं न चोदयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣṇan sūryaṃ na codayaḥ ||
Translation: And moving secm'st to speed the Sun.

Sanskit Text: अभि विप्रा अनूषत मूर्धन यज्ञस्य कारवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi viprā anūṣata mūrdhan yajñasya kāravaḥ |
Translation: 6 To him, the head of sacnfice, singers and bards have sung their songs,

Sanskit Text: दधानाश्चक्षसि परियम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhānāścakṣasi priyam ||
Translation: Offering what he loves to see.

Sanskit Text: तमु तवा वाजिनं नरो धीभिर्विप्रा अवस्यवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamu tvā vājinaṃ naro dhībhirviprā avasyavaḥ |
Translation: 7 The men, the sages with their hymns, eager for help, deck thee strong &teed,

Sanskit Text: मर्जन्तिदेवतातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mṛjantidevatātaye ||
Translation: Deck thee for service of the Gods.

Sanskit Text: मधोर्धारामनु कषर तीव्रः सधस्थमासदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhordhārāmanu kṣara tīvraḥ sadhasthamāsadaḥ |
Translation: 8 Flow onward to the stream of meath rest efficacious in thy home,

Sanskit Text: चारुरताय पीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cārurtāya pītaye ||
Translation: Fair, to be drunk at sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: परि सुवानो गिरिष्ठाः पवित्रे सोमो अक्षाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari suvāno ghiriṣṭhāḥ pavitre somo akṣāḥ |
Translation: 1. THOU, Soma, dweller on the hills, effused, hast flowed into the sieve,:

Sanskit Text: मदेषु सर्वधा असि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: madeṣu sarvadhā asi ||
Translation: All-bounteous art thou in carouse.

Sanskit Text: तवं विप्रस्त्वं कविर्मधु पर जातमन्धसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ viprastvaṃ kavirmadhu pra jātamandhasaḥ |
Translation: 2 Thou art a sacred Bard, a Sage; the meath is offipring of thy sap:

Sanskrit Transliteration: madeṣu... ||
Translation: All-bountcous art thou in carouse.

Sanskit Text: तव विश्वे सजोषसो देवासः पीतिमाशत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava viśve sajoṣaso devāsaḥ pītimāśata |
Translation: 3 All Deities of one accord have come that they may drink of thee:

Sanskrit Transliteration: madeṣu ... ||
Translation: All-bounteous art thou in carouse.

Sanskit Text: आ यो विश्वानि वार्या वसूनि हस्तयोर्दधे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yo viśvāni vāryā vasūni hastayordadhe |
Translation: 4 He who containeth in his hands all treasures much to be desired:

Sanskrit Transliteration: madeṣu ... ||
Translation: All-bounteous art thou in carouse.

Sanskit Text: य इमे रोदसी मही सं मातरेव दोहते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya ime rodasī mahī saṃ mātareva dohate |
Translation: 5 Who milketh out this mighty Pair, the Earth and Heaven, like mother kine

Sanskrit Transliteration: madeṣu ... ||
Translation: All-bounteous art thou in carouse.

Sanskit Text: परि यो रोदसी उभे सद्यो वाजेभिरर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari yo rodasī ubhe sadyo vājebhirarṣati |
Translation: 6 Who in a moment mightily floweth around these two world-halvcs:

Sanskrit Transliteration: madeṣu ... ||
Translation: All-bounteous art thou in carouse.

Sanskit Text: स शुष्मी कलशेष्वा पुनानो अचिक्रदत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa śuṣmī kalaśeṣvā punāno acikradat |
Translation: 7 The Strong One, being purified, hath in the pitchers cried aloud:

Sanskrit Transliteration: madeṣu ... ||
Translation: All-bounteous art thou in carouse.

Sanskit Text: यत सोम चित्रमुक्थ्यं दिव्यं पार्थिवं वसु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat soma citramukthyaṃ divyaṃ pārthivaṃ vasu |
Translation: 1. O SOMA, being purified bring us the wondrous treasure, meet

Sanskit Text: तन नः पुनान आ भर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan naḥ punāna ā bhara ||
Translation: For lauds, that is in earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: युवं हि सथः सवर्पती इन्द्रश्च सोम गोपती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ hi sthaḥ svarpatī indraśca soma ghopatī |
Translation: 2 For ye Twain, Indra, Soma, are Lords of the light, Lords of the kine:

Sanskit Text: ईशानापिप्यतं धियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: īśānāpipyataṃ dhiyaḥ ||
Translation: Great Rulers, prosper ye our songs.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा पुनान आयुषु सतनयन्नधि बर्हिषि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā punāna āyuṣu stanayannadhi barhiṣi |
Translation: 3 The tawny Steer, while cleansed among the living, bellowing on the grass,

Sanskit Text: हरिः सन योनिमासदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hariḥ san yonimāsadat ||
Translation: Hath sunk and settled in his home.

Sanskit Text: अवावशन्त धीतयो वर्षभस्याधि रेतसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avāvaśanta dhītayo vṛṣabhasyādhi retasi |
Translation: 4 Over the Steer's productive flow the sacred songs were resonant,

Sanskit Text: सूनोर्वत्सस्यमातरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūnorvatsasyamātaraḥ ||
Translation: The mothers of the darling Son.

Sanskit Text: कुविद वर्षण्यन्तीभ्यः पुनानो गर्भमादधत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvid vṛṣaṇyantībhyaḥ punāno gharbhamādadhat |
Translation: 5 Hath he not, purified, impregned the kine whb long to meet their Lord,

Sanskit Text: याः शुक्रं दुहते पयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāḥ śukraṃ duhate payaḥ ||
Translation: The kine who yield the shining milk?

Sanskit Text: उप शिक्षापतस्थुषो भियसमा धेहि शत्रुषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa śikṣāpatasthuṣo bhiyasamā dhehi śatruṣu |
Translation: 6 Bring near us those who stand aloof strike fear into our enemies:

Sanskit Text: पवमानविदा रयिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamānavidā rayim ||
Translation: O Pavamana, find us wealth.

Sanskit Text: नि शत्रोः सोम वर्ष्ण्यं नि शुष्मं नि वयस्तिर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni śatroḥ soma vṛṣṇyaṃ ni śuṣmaṃ ni vayastira |
Translation: 7 Soma, bring down the foeman's might, his vigorous strength and vital powe'r,

Sanskit Text: दूरेवा सतो अन्ति वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūrevā sato anti vā ||
Translation: Whether he be afar or near.

Sanskit Text: पर कविर्देववीतये.अव्यो वारेभिरर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra kavirdevavītaye.avyo vārebhirarṣati |
Translation: 1. FORTH through the straining-cloth the Sage flows to the banquet of the Gods,

Sanskit Text: साह्वान विश्वाभि सप्र्धः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sāhvān viśvāabhi spṛdhaḥ ||
Translation: Subduing all our enemies.

Sanskit Text: स हि षमा जरित्र्भ्य आ वाजं गोमन्तमिन्वति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi ṣmā jaritṛbhya ā vājaṃ ghomantaminvati |
Translation: 2 For he, as Pavamana, sends thousandfold treasure in the shape

Sanskit Text: पवमानः सहस्रिणम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamānaḥ sahasriṇam ||
Translation: Of cattle to the singing-men.

Sanskit Text: परि विश्वानि चेतसा मर्शसे पवसे मती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari viśvāni cetasā mṛśase pavase matī |
Translation: 3 Thou graspest all things with thy mind, and purifiest thee with thoughts

Sanskit Text: स नः सोम शरवो विदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ soma śravo vidaḥ ||
Translation: As such, O Soma, find us fame.

Sanskit Text: अभ्यर्ष बर्हद यशो मघवद्भ्यो धरुवं रयिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhyarṣa bṛhad yaśo maghavadbhyo dhruvaṃ rayim |
Translation: 4 Pour lofty glory on us, send sure riches to our liberal lords,

Sanskit Text: इषं सतोत्र्भ्य आ भर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara ||
Translation: Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

Sanskit Text: तवं राजेव सुव्रतो गिरः सोमा विवेशिथ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ rājeva suvrato ghiraḥ somā viveśitha |
Translation: 5 As thou art cleansed, O Wondrous Steed, O Soma, thou hast entered, like

Sanskit Text: पुनानो वह्ने अद्भुत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punāno vahne adbhuta ||
Translation: A pious King, into the songs.

Sanskit Text: स वह्निरप्सु दुष्टरो मर्ज्यमानो गभस्त्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vahnirapsu duṣṭaro mṛjyamāno ghabhastyoḥ |
Translation: 6 He, Soma, like a courser in the floods invincible, made clean

Sanskit Text: सोमश्चमूषु सीदति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaścamūṣu sīdati ||
Translation: With hands, is resting in the jars.

Sanskit Text: करीळुर्मखो न मंहयुः पवित्रं सोम गछसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: krīḷurmakho na maṃhayuḥ pavitraṃ soma ghachasi |
Translation: 7 Disporting, like a liberal chief, thou goest, Soma, to the sieve,

Sanskit Text: दधत सतोत्रे सुवीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhat stotre suvīryam ||
Translation: Lending the laud a Hero's strength.

Sanskit Text: एते धावन्तीन्दवः सोमा इन्द्राय घर्ष्वयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete dhāvantīndavaḥ somā indrāya ghṛṣvayaḥ |
Translation: 1. To Indra flow these running drops, these Somas frolicsome in mood.

Sanskit Text: मत्सरासःस्वर्विदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: matsarāsaḥsvarvidaḥ ||
Translation: Exhilarating, finding light;

Sanskit Text: परव्र्ण्वन्तो अभियुजः सुष्वये वरिवोविदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pravṛṇvanto abhiyujaḥ suṣvaye varivovidaḥ |
Translation: 2 Driving off foes, bestowing room upon the presser, willingly

Sanskit Text: सवयं सतोत्रे वयस्क्र्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svayaṃ stotre vayaskṛtaḥ ||
Translation: Bringing their praiser vitalforce.

Sanskit Text: वर्था करीळन्त इन्दवः सधस्थमभ्येकमित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛthā krīḷanta indavaḥ sadhasthamabhyekamit |
Translation: 3 Lightly disporting them, the drops flow to one common reservoir,

Sanskit Text: सिन्धोरूर्मा वयक्षरन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sindhorūrmā vyakṣaran ||
Translation: And fall into the river's wave.

Sanskit Text: एते विश्वानि वार्या पवमानास आशत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete viśvāni vāryā pavamānāsa āśata |
Translation: 4 These Pavamanas have obtained all blessings much to be desired,

Sanskit Text: हिता न सप्तयो रथे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hitā na saptayo rathe ||
Translation: Like coursers harnessed to a car.

Sanskit Text: आस्मिन पिशङगमिन्दवो दधाता वेनमादिशे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsmin piśaṅghamindavo dadhātā venamādiśe |
Translation: 5 With view to us, O Soma-drops, bestow his manifold desire

Sanskit Text: यो अस्मभ्यमरावा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo asmabhyamarāvā ||
Translation: On him who yet hath given us naught.

Sanskit Text: रभुर्न रथ्यं नवं दधाता केतमादिशे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛbhurna rathyaṃ navaṃ dadhātā ketamādiśe |
Translation: 6 Bring us our wish with this design, as a wright brings his new-wrought wheel:

Sanskit Text: शुक्राः पवध्वमर्णसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śukrāḥ pavadhvamarṇasā ||
Translation: Flow pure and shining with the stream.

Sanskit Text: एत उ तये अवीवशन काष्ठां वाजिनो अक्रत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eta u tye avīvaśan kāṣṭhāṃ vājino akrata |
Translation: 7 These drops have cried with resonant voice: like swift steeds they have run the course,

Sanskit Text: सतः परासाविषुर्मतिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sataḥ prāsāviṣurmatim ||
Translation: And roused the good man's hymn to life.

Sanskit Text: एते सोमास आशवो रथा इव पर वाजिनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete somāsa āśavo rathā iva pra vājinaḥ |
Translation: 1. THESE rapid Soma-streams have stirred themselves to motion like strong steeds,

Sanskit Text: सर्गाः सर्ष्टा अहेषत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarghāḥ sṛṣṭā aheṣata ||
Translation: Like cars, like armies hurried forth.

Sanskit Text: एते वाता इवोरवः पर्जन्यस्येव वर्ष्टयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete vātā ivoravaḥ parjanyasyeva vṛṣṭayaḥ |
Translation: 2 Swift as wide winds they lightly move, like rain-storms of Parjanya, like

Sanskit Text: अग्नेरिव भरमा वर्था ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghneriva bhramā vṛthā ||
Translation: The flickering flames of burning fire.

Sanskit Text: एते पूता विपश्चितः सोमासो दध्याशिरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete pūtā vipaścitaḥ somāso dadhyāśiraḥ |
Translation: 3 These Soma juices, blent with curds, purified, skilled in sacred hymns,

Sanskit Text: विपा वयानशुर्धियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vipā vyānaśurdhiyaḥ ||
Translation: Have gained by song their hearts'desire.

Sanskit Text: एते मर्ष्टा अमर्त्याः सस्र्वांसो न शश्रमुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete mṛṣṭā amartyāḥ sasṛvāṃso na śaśramuḥ |
Translation: 4 Immortal, cleansed, these drops, since first they flowed, have never wearied, fain

Sanskit Text: इयक्षन्तः पथो रजः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyakṣantaḥ patho rajaḥ ||
Translation: To reach the regions and their paths.

Sanskit Text: एते पर्ष्ठानि रोदसोर्विप्रयन्तो वयानशुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete pṛṣṭhāni rodasorviprayanto vyānaśuḥ |
Translation: 5 Advancing they have travelled o’er the ridges of the earth and heaven,

Sanskit Text: उतेदमुत्तमं रजः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utedamuttamaṃ rajaḥ ||
Translation: And this the highest realm of all.

Sanskit Text: तन्तुं तन्वानमुत्तममनु परवत आशत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tantuṃ tanvānamuttamamanu pravata āśata |
Translation: 6 Over the heights have they attained the highest thread that is spun out,

Sanskit Text: उतेदमुत्तमाय्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utedamuttamāyyam ||
Translation: And this which must be deemed most high.

Sanskit Text: तवं सोम पणिभ्य आ वसु गव्यानि धारयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ soma paṇibhya ā vasu ghavyāni dhārayaḥ |
Translation: 7 Thou, Soma, boldest wealth in kine which thou hast seized from niggard churls:

Sanskit Text: ततं तन्तुमचिक्रदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tataṃ tantumacikradaḥ ||
Translation: Thou calledst forth the outspun thread.

Sanskit Text: सोमा अस्र्ग्रमाशवो मधोर्मदस्य धारया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somā asṛghramāśavo madhormadasya dhārayā |
Translation: 1. SWIFT Soma drops have been effused in streams of meath, the gladdening drink,

Sanskit Text: अभि विश्वानिकाव्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi viśvānikāvyā ||
Translation: For sacred lore of every kind.

Sanskit Text: अनु परत्नास आयवः पदं नवीयो अक्रमुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu pratnāsa āyavaḥ padaṃ navīyo akramuḥ |
Translation: 2 Hither to newer. resting-place the ancient Living Ones are come.

Sanskit Text: रुचे जनन्त सूर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ruce jananta sūryam ||
Translation: They made the Sun that he might shine.

Sanskit Text: आ पवमान नो भरार्यो अदाशुषो गयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā pavamāna no bharāryo adāśuṣo ghayam |
Translation: 3 O Pavamana, bring to us the unsacrificing foeman's wealth,

Sanskit Text: कर्धि परजावतीरिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛdhi prajāvatīriṣaḥ ||
Translation: And give us food with progeny.

Sanskit Text: अभि सोमास आयवः पवन्ते मद्यं मदम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi somāsa āyavaḥ pavante madyaṃ madam |
Translation: 4 The living Somas being cleansed diffuse exhilarating drink,

Sanskit Text: अभि कोशं मधुश्चुतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi kośaṃ madhuścutam ||
Translation: Turned to the vat which drips with meath.

Sanskit Text: सोमो अर्षति धर्णसिर्दधान इन्द्रियं रसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somo arṣati dharṇasirdadhāna indriyaṃ rasam |
Translation: 5 Soma gows on intelligent, possessing sap and mighty strength,

Sanskit Text: सुवीरो अभिशस्तिपाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvīro abhiśastipāḥ ||
Translation: Brave Hero who repels the curse.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय सोम पवसे देवेभ्यः सधमाद्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya soma pavase devebhyaḥ sadhamādyaḥ |
Translation: 6 For Indra, Soma! thou art cleansed, a feast-companion for the Gods:

Sanskit Text: इन्दो वाजं सिषाससि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indo vājaṃ siṣāsasi ||
Translation: 1ndu, thou fain wilt win us strength

Sanskit Text: अस्य पीत्वा मदानामिन्द्रो वर्त्राण्यप्रति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya pītvā madānāmindro vṛtrāṇyaprati |
Translation: 7 When he had drunken draughts of this, Indra smote down resistless foes:

Sanskit Text: जघान जघनच्च नु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jaghāna jaghanacca nu ||
Translation: Yea, smote them, and shall smite them still.

Sanskit Text: पवस्व दक्षसाधनो देवेभ्यः पीतये हरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva dakṣasādhano devebhyaḥ pītaye hare |
Translation: 1. GREEN-HUED! as one who giveth strength flow on for Gods to drink, a draught

Sanskit Text: मरुद्भ्यो वायवे मदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: marudbhyo vāyave madaḥ ||
Translation: For Vāyu and the Marut host.

Sanskit Text: पवमान धिया हितो.अभि योनिं कनिक्रदत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamāna dhiyā hito.abhi yoniṃ kanikradat |
Translation: 2 O Pavamana, sent by song, roaring about thy dwelling-place,

Sanskit Text: धर्मणा वायुमा विश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dharmaṇā vāyumā viśa ||
Translation: Pass into Vāyu as Law bids.

Sanskit Text: सं देवैः शोभते वर्षा कविर्योनावधि परियः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ devaiḥ śobhate vṛṣā kaviryonāvadhi priyaḥ |
Translation: 3 The Steer shines with the Deities, dear Sage in his appointed home,

Sanskit Text: वर्त्रहा देववीतमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛtrahā devavītamaḥ ||
Translation: Foe-Slayer, most beloved by Gods.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा रूपाण्याविशन पुनानो याति हर्यतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā rūpāṇyāviśan punāno yāti haryataḥ |
Translation: 4 Taking each beauteous form, he goes, desirable, while purified,

Sanskit Text: यत्राम्र्तास आसते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatrāmṛtāsa āsate ||
Translation: Thither where- the Immortals sit.

Sanskit Text: अरुषो जनयन गिरः सोमः पवत आयुषक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aruṣo janayan ghiraḥ somaḥ pavata āyuṣak |
Translation: 5 To Indra Soma flows, the Red, engendering song, exceeding wise,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं गछन कविक्रतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ ghachan kavikratuḥ ||
Translation: The visitor of living men.

Sanskit Text: आ पवस्व मदिन्तम पवित्रं धारया कवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā pavasva madintama pavitraṃ dhārayā kave |
Translation: 6 Flow, best exhilarator, Sage, flow to the filter in a stream

Sanskit Text: अर्कस्य योनिमासदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arkasya yonimāsadam ||
Translation: To seat thee in the place of song.

Sanskit Text: तमम्र्क्षन्त वाजिनमुपस्थे अदितेरधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamamṛkṣanta vājinamupasthe aditeradhi |
Translation: 1. THE sages with the fingers' art have dressed and decked that vigorous Steed

Sanskit Text: विप्रासो अण्व्याधिया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viprāso aṇvyādhiyā ||
Translation: Upon the lap of Aditi,

Sanskit Text: तं गावो अभ्यनूषत सहस्रधारमक्षितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ ghāvo abhyanūṣata sahasradhāramakṣitam |
Translation: 2 The kine have called aloud to him exhaustless with a thousand streams,

Sanskit Text: इन्दुं धर्तारमा दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: induṃ dhartāramā divaḥ ||
Translation: To Indu who supporteth heaven.

Sanskit Text: तं वेधां मेधयाह्यन पवमानमधि दयवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vedhāṃ medhayāhyan pavamānamadhi dyavi |
Translation: 3 Him, nourisher of many, Sage, creative Pavamana, they

Sanskit Text: धर्णसिं भूरिधायसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dharṇasiṃ bhūridhāyasam ||
Translation: Have sent, by wisdom, to the sky.

Sanskit Text: तमह्यन भुरिजोर्धिया संवसानं विवस्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamahyan bhurijordhiyā saṃvasānaṃ vivasvataḥ |
Translation: 4 Him, dweller with Vivasvān, they with use of both arms have sent forth,

Sanskit Text: पतिं वाचो अदाभ्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: patiṃ vāco adābhyam ||
Translation: The Lord of Speech infallible.

Sanskit Text: तं सानावधि जामयो हरिं हिन्वन्त्यद्रिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ sānāvadhi jāmayo hariṃ hinvantyadribhiḥ |
Translation: 5 Him, green, beloved, many eyed, the Sisters with prosing stones

Sanskit Text: हर्यतम्भूरिचक्षसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: haryatambhūricakṣasam ||
Translation: Send down to ridges of the sieve.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा हिन्वन्ति वेधसः पवमान गिराव्र्धम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā hinvanti vedhasaḥ pavamāna ghirāvṛdham |
Translation: 6 O Pavamana, Indu, priests hurry thee on to Indra, thee

Sanskit Text: इन्दविन्द्राय मत्सरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indavindrāya matsaram ||
Translation: Who aidest song and cheerest him.

Sanskit Text: एष कविरभिष्टुतः पवित्रे अधि तोशते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa kavirabhiṣṭutaḥ pavitre adhi tośate |
Translation: 1. THIS Sage, exalted by our lauds, flows to the purifying cloth,

Sanskit Text: पुनानो घनन्नप सरिधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punāno ghnannapa sridhaḥ ||
Translation: Scattering foes as he is cleansed.

Sanskit Text: एष इन्द्राय वायवे सवर्जित परि षिच्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa indrāya vāyave svarjit pari ṣicyate |
Translation: 2 As giving power and winning light, for Indra and for Vāyu he

Sanskit Text: पवित्रे दक्षसाधनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavitre dakṣasādhanaḥ ||
Translation: Is poured upon the filtering-cloth.

Sanskit Text: एष नर्भिर्वि नीयते दिवो मूर्धा वर्षा सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa nṛbhirvi nīyate divo mūrdhā vṛṣā sutaḥ |
Translation: 3 The men conduct him, Soma, Steer, Omniscient, and the Head of Heaven,

Sanskit Text: सोमो वनेषु विश्ववित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somo vaneṣu viśvavit ||
Translation: Effused into the vats of wood.

Sanskit Text: एष गव्युरचिक्रदत पवमानो हिरण्ययुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa ghavyuracikradat pavamāno hiraṇyayuḥ |
Translation: 4 Longing for kine, longing for gold hath Indu Pavamana lowed,

Sanskit Text: इन्दुः सत्राजिदस्त्र्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: induḥ satrājidastṛtaḥ ||
Translation: Still Conqueror, never overcome.

Sanskit Text: एष सूर्येण हासते पवमानो अधि दयवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa sūryeṇa hāsate pavamāno adhi dyavi |
Translation: 5 This Pavamana, gladdening draught, drops on the filtering cloth, and then

Sanskit Text: पवित्रे मत्सरो मदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavitre matsaro madaḥ ||
Translation: Mounts up with Sūrya to the sky.

Sanskit Text: एष शुष्म्यसिष्यददन्तरिक्षे वर्षा हरिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa śuṣmyasiṣyadadantarikṣe vṛṣā hariḥ |
Translation: 6 To Indra in the firmament this mighty tawny Steer hath flowed,

Sanskit Text: पुनान इन्दुरिन्द्रमा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punāna indurindramā ||
Translation: This Indu, being purified.

Sanskit Text: एष वाजी हितो नर्भिर्विश्वविन मनसस पतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa vājī hito nṛbhirviśvavin manasas patiḥ |
Translation: 1. URGED by the men, this vigorous Steed, Lord of the mind, Omniscient,

Sanskit Text: अव्यो वारं वि धावति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avyo vāraṃ vi dhāvati ||
Translation: Runs to the woollen straining-cloth.

Sanskit Text: एष पवित्रे अक्षरत सोमो देवेभ्यः सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa pavitre akṣarat somo devebhyaḥ sutaḥ |
Translation: 2 Within the filter hath he flowed, this Soma for the Gods effused,

Sanskit Text: विश्वा धामान्याविशन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā dhāmānyāviśan ||
Translation: Entering all their essences.

Sanskit Text: एष देवः शुभायते.अधि योनावमर्त्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa devaḥ śubhāyate.adhi yonāvamartyaḥ |
Translation: 3 He shines in beauty there, this God Immortal in his dwelling-place,

Sanskit Text: वर्त्रहा देववीतमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛtrahā devavītamaḥ ||
Translation: Foe-slayer, dearest to the Gods.

Sanskit Text: एष वर्षा कनिक्रदद दशभिर्जामिभिर्यतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa vṛṣā kanikradad daśabhirjāmibhiryataḥ |
Translation: 4 Directed by the Sisters ten, bellowing on his way this Steer

Sanskit Text: अभि दरोणानि धावति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi droṇāni dhāvati ||
Translation: Runs onward to the wooden vats.

Sanskit Text: एष सूर्यमरोचयत पवमानो विचर्षणिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa sūryamarocayat pavamāno vicarṣaṇiḥ |
Translation: 5 This Pavamana, swiftand strong, Omniscient, gave spleudour to

Sanskit Text: विश्वा धामानि विश्ववित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā dhāmāni viśvavit ||
Translation: The Sun and all his forms of light.

Sanskit Text: एष शुष्म्यदाभ्यः सोमः पुनानो अर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa śuṣmyadābhyaḥ somaḥ punāno arṣati |
Translation: 6 This Soma being purified, flows mighty and infallible,

Sanskit Text: देवावीरघशंसहा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāvīraghaśaṃsahā ||
Translation: Slayer of sinners, dear toGods.

Sanskit Text: परास्य धारा अक्षरन वर्ष्णः सुतस्यौजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāsya dhārā akṣaran vṛṣṇaḥ sutasyaujasā |
Translation: 1. FORWARD with mighty force have flowed the currents of this Steer effused,

Sanskit Text: देवाननु परभूषतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānanu prabhūṣataḥ ||
Translation: Of him who sets him by the Gods.

Sanskit Text: सप्तिं मर्जन्ति वेधसो गर्णन्तः कारवो गिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saptiṃ mṛjanti vedhaso ghṛṇantaḥ kāravo ghirā |
Translation: 2 The singers praise him with their song, and learned priests adorn the Steed,

Sanskit Text: जयोतिर्जज्ञानमुक्थ्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyotirjajñānamukthyam ||
Translation: Brought forth as light that merits laud.

Sanskit Text: सुषहा सोम तानि ते पुनानाय परभूवसो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suṣahā soma tāni te punānāya prabhūvaso |
Translation: 3 These things thou winnest lightly while purified, Soma, Lord of wealth:

Sanskit Text: वर्धा समुद्रमुक्थ्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vardhā samudramukthyam ||
Translation: Fill full the sea that claims our praise.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा वसूनि संजयन पवस्व सोम धारया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā vasūni saṃjayan pavasva soma dhārayā |
Translation: 4 Winning all precious things at once, flow on, O Soma, with thy stream

Sanskit Text: इनु दवेषांसि सध्र्यक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: inu dveṣāṃsi sadhryak ||
Translation: Drive to one place our enemies.

Sanskit Text: रक्षा सु नो अररुषः सवनात समस्य कस्य चित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rakṣā su no araruṣaḥ svanāt samasya kasya cit |
Translation: 5 Preserve us from the godless, from ill-omened voice of one and all,

Sanskit Text: निदो यत्रमुमुच्महे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nido yatramumucmahe ||
Translation: That so we may be freed from blame.

Sanskit Text: एन्दो पार्थिवं रयिं दिव्यं पवस्व धारया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: endo pārthivaṃ rayiṃ divyaṃ pavasva dhārayā |
Translation: 6 O Indu, as thou flowest on bring us the wealth of earth and heaven,

Sanskit Text: दयुमन्तं शुष्ममा भर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyumantaṃ śuṣmamā bhara ||
Translation: And splendid vigour, in thy stream.

Sanskit Text: पर धारा अस्य शुष्मिणो वर्था पवित्रे अक्षरन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra dhārā asya śuṣmiṇo vṛthā pavitre akṣaran |
Translation: 1. STREAMS of this Potent One have flowed easily to the straining-cloth:

Sanskit Text: पुनानो वाचमिष्यति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punāno vācamiṣyati ||
Translation: While he is cleansed he lifts his voice.

Sanskit Text: इन्दुर्हियानः सोत्र्भिर्म्र्ज्यमानः कनिक्रदत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indurhiyānaḥ sotṛbhirmṛjyamānaḥ kanikradat |
Translation: 2 Indu, by pressers urged to speed, bellowing out while beautified.

Sanskit Text: इयर्ति वग्नुमिन्द्रियम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyarti vaghnumindriyam ||
Translation: Sends forth a very mighty sound.

Sanskit Text: आ नः शुष्मं नर्षाह्यं वीरवन्तं पुरुस्प्र्हम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā naḥ śuṣmaṃ nṛṣāhyaṃ vīravantaṃ puruspṛham |
Translation: 3 Pour on us, Soma, with thy stream manconquering might which many crave,

Sanskit Text: पवस्व सोम धारया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva soma dhārayā ||
Translation: Accompanied with hero sons.

Sanskit Text: पर सोमो अति धारया पवमानो असिष्यदत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra somo ati dhārayā pavamāno asiṣyadat |
Translation: 4 Hither hath Pavamana flowed, Soma flowed hither in a stream,

Sanskit Text: अभि दरोणान्यासदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi droṇānyāsadam ||
Translation: To settle in the vats of wood.

Sanskit Text: अप्सु तवा मधुमत्तमं हरिं हिन्वन्त्यद्रिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apsu tvā madhumattamaṃ hariṃ hinvantyadribhiḥ |
Translation: 5 To waters with the stones they drive thee tawny-hued, most rich in sweets,

Sanskit Text: इन्दविन्द्राय पीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indavindrāya pītaye ||
Translation: O Indu, to be Indra's drink.

Sanskit Text: सुनोता मधुमत्तमं सोममिन्द्राय वज्रिणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sunotā madhumattamaṃ somamindrāya vajriṇe |
Translation: 6 For Indra, for the Thunderer press the Soma very rich in sweets,

Sanskit Text: चारुं शर्धाय मत्सरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cāruṃ śardhāya matsaram ||
Translation: Lovely, inspiriting, for strength.

Sanskit Text: पर सोमासः सवाध्यः पवमानासो अक्रमुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra somāsaḥ svādhyaḥ pavamānāso akramuḥ |
Translation: 1. THE, Soma-drops, benevolent, come forth as they are purified,

Sanskit Text: रयिं कर्ण्वन्तिचेतनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rayiṃ kṛṇvanticetanam ||
Translation: Bestowing wealth which all may see.

Sanskit Text: दिवस पर्थिव्या अधि भवेन्दो दयुम्नवर्धनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divas pṛthivyā adhi bhavendo dyumnavardhanaḥ |
Translation: 2 O Indu, high o’er heaven and earth be thou, increaser of our might:

Sanskit Text: भवा वाजानां पतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhavā vājānāṃ patiḥ ||
Translation: The Master of all strength be thou.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्यं वाता अभिप्रियस्तुभ्यमर्षन्ति सिन्धवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyaṃ vātā abhipriyastubhyamarṣanti sindhavaḥ |
Translation: 3 The winds are gracious in their love to thee, the rivers flow to thee

Sanskit Text: सोम वर्धन्ति ते महः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: soma vardhanti te mahaḥ ||
Translation: Soma, they multiply thy power.

Sanskit Text: आ पयायस्व समेतु ते विश्वतः सोम वर्ष्ण्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā pyāyasva sametu te viśvataḥ soma vṛṣṇyam |
Translation: 4 Soma, wax great. From every side may vigorous powers unite in thee:

Sanskit Text: भवा वाजस्य संगथे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhavā vājasya saṃghathe ||
Translation: Be in the gathering-Place of strength.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्यं गावो घर्तं पयो बभ्रो दुदुह्रे अक्षितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyaṃ ghāvo ghṛtaṃ payo babhro duduhre akṣitam |
Translation: 5 For thee, brown-hued! the kine have poured imperishable oil and milk.

Sanskit Text: वर्षिष्ठे अधि सानवि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: varṣiṣṭhe adhi sānavi ||
Translation: Aloft on the sublimest height.

Sanskit Text: सवायुधस्य ते सतो भुवनस्य पते वयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāyudhasya te sato bhuvanasya pate vayam |
Translation: 6 Friendship, O Indu, we desire with thee who bearest noble arms,

Sanskit Text: इन्दो सखित्वमुश्मसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indo sakhitvamuśmasi ||
Translation: With thee, O Lord of all that is.

Sanskit Text: पर सोमासो मदच्युतः शरवसे नो मघोनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra somāso madacyutaḥ śravase no maghonaḥ |
Translation: 1. THE rapture-shedding Soma-drops, effused in our assembly, have

Sanskit Text: सुता विदथे अक्रमुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sutā vidathe akramuḥ ||
Translation: Flowed forth to glorify our prince.

Sanskit Text: आदीं तरितस्य योषणो हरिं हिन्वन्त्यद्रिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādīṃ tritasya yoṣaṇo hariṃ hinvantyadribhiḥ |
Translation: 2 Then Trita's Maidens onward urge the Tawny-coloured with the stones,

Sanskit Text: इन्दुमिन्द्राय पीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indumindrāya pītaye ||
Translation: Indu for Indra, for his drink.

Sanskit Text: आदीं हंसो यथा गणं विश्वस्यावीवशन मतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādīṃ haṃso yathā ghaṇaṃ viśvasyāvīvaśan matim |
Translation: 3 Now like a swan he maketh all the company sing each his hymn:

Sanskit Text: अत्योन गोभिरज्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atyona ghobhirajyate ||
Translation: He, like a steed, is bathed in milk.

Sanskit Text: उभे सोमावचाकशन मर्गो न तक्तो अर्षसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhe somāvacākaśan mṛgho na takto arṣasi |
Translation: 4 O Soma, viewing heaven and earth, thou runncst like a darting deer

Sanskit Text: सीदन्न्र्तस्य योनिमा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sīdannṛtasya yonimā ||
Translation: Set in the place of sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: अभि गावो अनूषत योषा जारमिव परियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi ghāvo anūṣata yoṣā jāramiva priyam |
Translation: 5 The cows have sung with joy to him, even as a woman to her love

Sanskit Text: अगन्नाजिं यथा हितम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghannājiṃ yathā hitam ||
Translation: He came as to a settled race.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे धेहि दयुमद यशो मघवद्भ्यश्च मह्यं च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme dhehi dyumad yaśo maghavadbhyaśca mahyaṃ ca |
Translation: 6 Bestow illustrious fame on us, both on our liberal lords and me,

Sanskit Text: सनिं मेधामुत शरवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saniṃ medhāmuta śravaḥ ||
Translation: Glory, intelligence, and wealth.

Sanskit Text: पर सोमासो विपश्चितो.अपां न यन्त्यूर्मयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra somāso vipaścito.apāṃ na yantyūrmayaḥ |
Translation: 1. LIKE waves of waters, skilled in song the juices of the Soma speed

Sanskit Text: वनानि महिषा इव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanāni mahiṣā iva ||
Translation: Onward, as buffaloes to woods.

Sanskit Text: अभि दरोणानि बभ्रवः शुक्रा रतस्य धारया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi droṇāni babhravaḥ śukrā ṛtasya dhārayā |
Translation: 2 With stream of sacrifice the brown bright drops have flowed with strength in store

Sanskit Text: वाजं गोमन्तमक्षरन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājaṃ ghomantamakṣaran ||
Translation: Of kine into the wooden vats.

Sanskit Text: सुता इन्द्राय वायवे वरुणाय मरुद्भ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sutā indrāya vāyave varuṇāya marudbhyaḥ |
Translation: 3 To Indra, Vāyu, Varuṇa, to Viṣṇu, and the Maruts, flow

Sanskit Text: सोमा अर्षन्ति विष्णवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somā arṣanti viṣṇave ||
Translation: The drops of Soma juice effused.

Sanskit Text: तिस्रो वाच उदीरते गावो मिमन्ति धेनवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisro vāca udīrate ghāvo mimanti dhenavaḥ |
Translation: 4 Three several words are uttered: kine are ]owing, cows who give their milk:

Sanskit Text: हरिरेति कनिक्रदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: harireti kanikradat ||
Translation: The Tawny-hued goes bellowing on.

Sanskit Text: अभि बरह्मीरनूषत यह्वीरतस्य मातरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi brahmīranūṣata yahvīrtasya mātaraḥ |
Translation: 5 The young and sacred mothers of the holy rite have uttered praise:

Sanskit Text: मर्म्र्ज्यन्ते दिवः शिशुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: marmṛjyante divaḥ śiśum ||
Translation: They decorate the Child of Heaven.

Sanskit Text: रायः समुद्रांश्चतुरो.अस्मभ्यं सोम विश्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyaḥ samudrāṃścaturo.asmabhyaṃ soma viśvataḥ |
Translation: 6 From every side, O Soma, for our profit, pour thou forth four seas

Sanskit Text: आ पवस्व सहस्रिणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā pavasva sahasriṇaḥ ||
Translation: Filled full of riches thousandfold.

Sanskit Text: पर सुवानो धारया तनेन्दुर्हिन्वानो अर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra suvāno dhārayā tanendurhinvāno arṣati |
Translation: 1. THE drop of Soma juice effused flows onward with this stream impelled.

Sanskit Text: रुजद दर्ळ्हा वयोजसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rujad dṛḷhā vyojasā ||
Translation: Rending strong places with its might.

Sanskit Text: सुत इन्द्राय वायवे वरुणाय मरुद्भ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suta indrāya vāyave varuṇāya marudbhyaḥ |
Translation: 2 Poured forth to Indra, Varuṇa, to Vāyu and the Marut hosts,

Sanskit Text: सोमो अर्षति विष्णवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somo arṣati viṣṇave ||
Translation: To Viṣṇu, flows the Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: वर्षाणं वर्षभिर्यतं सुन्वन्ति सोममद्रिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣāṇaṃ vṛṣabhiryataṃ sunvanti somamadribhiḥ |
Translation: 3 With stones they press the Soma forth, the Strong conducted by the strong:

Sanskit Text: दुहन्तिशक्मना पयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: duhantiśakmanā payaḥ ||
Translation: They milk the liquor out with skill.

Sanskit Text: भुवत तरितस्य मर्ज्यो भुवदिन्द्राय मत्सरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhuvat tritasya marjyo bhuvadindrāya matsaraḥ |
Translation: 4 ’Tis he whom Trita must refine, ’tis he who shall make Indra glad:

Sanskit Text: सं रूपैरज्यते हरिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ rūpairajyate hariḥ ||
Translation: The Tawny One is decked with tints.

Sanskit Text: अभीं रतस्य विष्टपं दुहते पर्श्निमातरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhīṃ ṛtasya viṣṭapaṃ duhate pṛśnimātaraḥ |
Translation: 5 Him do the Sons of Pṛśni milk, the dwelling-place of sacrifice,

Sanskit Text: चारु परियतमं हविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cāru priyatamaṃ haviḥ ||
Translation: Oblation lovely and most dear.

Sanskit Text: समेनमह्रुता इमा गिरो अर्षन्ति सस्रुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samenamahrutā imā ghiro arṣanti sasrutaḥ |
Translation: 6 To him in one unitcd stream th-,se songs flow on straight forward. he,

Sanskit Text: धेनूर्वाश्रोवीवशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhenūrvāśroavīvaśat ||
Translation: Loud voiced, hath made the milch-kine low.

Sanskit Text: आ नः पवस्व धारया पवमान रयिं पर्थुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā naḥ pavasva dhārayā pavamāna rayiṃ pṛthum |
Translation: 1. Pour forth on us abundant wealth, O Pavamana, with thy stream.

Sanskit Text: यया जयोतिर्विदासि नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayā jyotirvidāsi naḥ ||
Translation: Wherewith thou mayest find us light

Sanskit Text: इन्दो समुद्रमीङखय पवस्व विश्वमेजय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indo samudramīṅkhaya pavasva viśvamejaya |
Translation: 2 O Indu, swayer of the sea, shaker of all things, flow thou on,

Sanskit Text: रायो धर्ता न ओजसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyo dhartā na ojasā ||
Translation: Bearer of wealth to us with might.

Sanskit Text: तवया वीरेण वीरवो.अभि षयाम पर्तन्यतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā vīreṇa vīravo.abhi ṣyāma pṛtanyataḥ |
Translation: 3 With thee for Hero, Valiant One! may we subdue our enemies:

Sanskit Text: कषरा णो अभि वार्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣarā ṇo abhi vāryam ||
Translation: Let what is precious flow to us.

Sanskit Text: पर वाजमिन्दुरिष्यति सिषासन वाजसा रषिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vājaminduriṣyati siṣāsan vājasā ṛṣiḥ |
Translation: 4 Indu arouses strength the Sage who strives for victory, winning power,

Sanskit Text: वरता विदान आयुधा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vratā vidāna āyudhā ||
Translation: Discovering holy works and means.

Sanskit Text: तं गीर्भिर्वाचमीङखयं पुनानं वासयामसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ ghīrbhirvācamīṅkhayaṃ punānaṃ vāsayāmasi |
Translation: 5 Mover of speech, we robe him with our songs as he is purified

Sanskit Text: सोमं जनस्य गोपतिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaṃ janasya ghopatim ||
Translation: Soma, the Guardian of the folk;

Sanskit Text: विश्वो यस्य वरते जनो दाधार धर्मणस पतेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvo yasya vrate jano dādhāra dharmaṇas pateḥ |
Translation: 6 On whose way, Lord of Holy Law, most richi as he is purified.

Sanskit Text: पुनानस्य परभूवसोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punānasya prabhūvasoḥ ||
Translation: The people all have set their hearts.

Sanskit Text: असर्जि रथ्यो यथा पवित्रे चम्वोः सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asarji rathyo yathā pavitre camvoḥ sutaḥ |
Translation: 1. FORTH from the mortar is the juice sent, like a car-horse, to the sieve:

Sanskit Text: कार्ष्मन वाजीन्यक्रमीत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kārṣman vājīnyakramīt ||
Translation: The Steed steps forward to the goal.

Sanskit Text: स वह्निः सोम जाग्र्विः पवस्व देववीरति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vahniḥ soma jāghṛviḥ pavasva devavīrati |
Translation: 2 Thus, Soma, watchful, bearing well, cheering the Gods, flow past the sieve,

Sanskit Text: अभि कोशं मधुश्चुतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi kośaṃ madhuścutam ||
Translation: Turned to the vat that drops with meath.

Sanskit Text: स नो जयोतींषि पूर्व्य पवमान वि रोचय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no jyotīṃṣi pūrvya pavamāna vi rocaya |
Translation: 3 Excellent Pavamana, make the lights shine brightly out for us.

Sanskit Text: करत्वे दक्षायनो हिनु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratve dakṣāyano hinu ||
Translation: Speed us to mental power and skill.

Sanskit Text: शुम्भमानो रतायुभिर्म्र्ज्यमानो गभस्त्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śumbhamāno ṛtāyubhirmṛjyamāno ghabhastyoḥ |
Translation: 4 He, beautified by pious men, and coming from their hands adorned,

Sanskit Text: पवते वारे अव्यये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavate vāre avyaye ||
Translation: Flows through the fleecy straining-cloth.

Sanskit Text: स विश्वा दाशुषे वसु सोमो दिव्यानि पार्थिवा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa viśvā dāśuṣe vasu somo divyāni pārthivā |
Translation: 5 May Soma pour all treasures of the heavens, the earth, the firmament

Sanskit Text: पवतामान्तरिक्ष्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavatāmāntarikṣyā ||
Translation: Upon the liberal worshipper.

Sanskit Text: आ दिवस पर्ष्ठमश्वयुर्गव्ययुः सोम रोहसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā divas pṛṣṭhamaśvayurghavyayuḥ soma rohasi |
Translation: 6 Thou mountest to the height of heaven, O Soma, seeking steeds and kine,

Sanskit Text: वीरयुः शवसस पते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vīrayuḥ śavasas pate ||
Translation: And seeking heroes, Lord of Strength!

Sanskit Text: स सुतः पीतये वर्षा सोमः पवित्रे अर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sutaḥ pītaye vṛṣā somaḥ pavitre arṣati |
Translation: 1. SOMA, the Steer, effused for draught, flows to the purifying sieve,

Sanskit Text: विघ्नन रक्षांसि देवयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vighnan rakṣāṃsi devayuḥ ||
Translation: Slaying the fiends, loving the Gods.

Sanskit Text: स पवित्रे विचक्षणो हरिरर्षति धर्णसिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pavitre vicakṣaṇo harirarṣati dharṇasiḥ |
Translation: 2 Far-sighted, tawny-coloured, he flows to the sieve, intelligent,

Sanskit Text: अभि योनिंकनिक्रदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi yoniṃkanikradat ||
Translation: Bellowing, to his place of rest.

Sanskit Text: स वाजी रोचना दिवः पवमानो वि धावति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vājī rocanā divaḥ pavamāno vi dhāvati |
Translation: 3 This vigorous Pavamana runs forth to the luminous realm of heaven,

Sanskit Text: रक्षोहा वारमव्ययम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rakṣohā vāramavyayam ||
Translation: Fiend-slayer, through the fleecy sieve.

Sanskit Text: स तरितस्याधि सानवि पवमानो अरोचयत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tritasyādhi sānavi pavamāno arocayat |
Translation: 4 This Payamana up above Trita's high ridge hath made the Sun,

Sanskit Text: जामिभिः सूर्यं सह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jāmibhiḥ sūryaṃ saha ||
Translation: Together with the Sisters, shine.

Sanskit Text: स वर्त्रहा वर्षा सुतो वरिवोविददाभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vṛtrahā vṛṣā suto varivovidadābhyaḥ |
Translation: 5 This Vṛtra-slaying Steer, effused, Soma room-giver, ne’er deceived,

Sanskit Text: सोमो वाजमिवासरत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somo vājamivāsarat ||
Translation: Hath gone, as ’twere, to win the spoil.

Sanskit Text: स देवः कविनेषितो.अभि दरोणानि धावति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa devaḥ kavineṣito.abhi droṇāni dhāvati |
Translation: 6 Urged onward by the sage, the God speeds forward to the casks of wood,

Sanskit Text: इन्दुरिन्द्रायमंहना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indurindrāyamaṃhanā ||
Translation: Indu to Indra willingly.

Sanskit Text: आशुरर्ष बर्हन्मते परि परियेण धाम्ना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āśurarṣa bṛhanmate pari priyeṇa dhāmnā |
Translation: 1. FLOW On, O thou of lofty thought, flow swift in thy beloved form,

Sanskit Text: यत्र देवा इतिब्रवन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatra devā itibravan ||
Translation: Saying, I go where dwell the Gods.

Sanskit Text: परिष्क्र्ण्वन्ननिष्क्र्तं जनाय यातयन्निषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pariṣkṛṇvannaniṣkṛtaṃ janāya yātayanniṣaḥ |
Translation: 2 Preparing what is unprepared, and bringing store of food to man,

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्टिन्दिवः परि सरव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṭindivaḥ pari srava ||
Translation: Make thou the rain descend from heaven.

Sanskit Text: सुत एति पवित्र आ तविषिं दधान ओजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suta eti pavitra ā tviṣiṃ dadhāna ojasā |
Translation: 3 With might, bestowing power, thejuice enters the purifying sieve,

Sanskit Text: विचक्षाणो विरोचयन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vicakṣāṇo virocayan ||
Translation: Far-seeing, sending forth its light.

Sanskit Text: अयं स यो दिवस परि रघुयामा पवित्र आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ sa yo divas pari raghuyāmā pavitra ā |
Translation: 4 This is it which in rapid course hath with the river's wave flowed down

Sanskit Text: सिन्धोरूर्मा वयक्षरत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sindhorūrmā vyakṣarat ||
Translation: From heaven upon the straining cloth.

Sanskit Text: आविवासन परावतो अथो अर्वावतः सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvivāsan parāvato atho arvāvataḥ sutaḥ |
Translation: 5 Inviting him frorh far away, and even from near at hand, the juice

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय सिच्यतेमधु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya sicyatemadhu ||
Translation: For Indra is poured forth as meath.

Sanskit Text: समीचीना अनूषत हरिं हिन्वन्त्यद्रिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samīcīnā anūṣata hariṃ hinvantyadribhiḥ |
Translation: 6 In union they have sung the hymn: with stones they urge the Tawny One.

Sanskit Text: योनाव रतस्य सीदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yonāv ṛtasya sīdata ||
Translation: Sit in the place of sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: पर ये गावो न भूर्णयस्त्वेषा अयासो अक्रमुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ye ghāvo na bhūrṇayastveṣā ayāso akramuḥ |
Translation: 1. ACTIVE and bright have they come forth, impetuous in speed like bulls,

Sanskit Text: घनन्तः कर्ष्णामप तवचम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghnantaḥ kṛṣṇāmapa tvacam ||
Translation: Driving the black skin far away.

Sanskit Text: सुवितस्य मनामहे.अति सेतुं दुराव्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvitasya manāmahe.ati setuṃ durāvyam |
Translation: 2 Quelling the riteless Dasyu, may we think upon the bridge of bliss,

Sanskit Text: साह्वांसो दस्युमव्रतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sāhvāṃso dasyumavratam ||
Translation: Leaving the bridge of woe behind.

Sanskit Text: शर्ण्वे वर्ष्टेरिव सवनः पवमानस्य शुष्मिणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇve vṛṣṭeriva svanaḥ pavamānasya śuṣmiṇaḥ |
Translation: 3 The mighty Pavamana's roar is heard as ’twere the rush of rain

Sanskit Text: चरन्तिविद्युतो दिवि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: carantividyuto divi ||
Translation: Lightnings are flashing to the sky.

Sanskit Text: आ पवस्व महीमिषं गोमदिन्दो हिरण्यवत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā pavasva mahīmiṣaṃ ghomadindo hiraṇyavat |
Translation: 4 Pour out on us abundant food, when thou art pressed, O Indu wealth

Sanskit Text: अश्वावद वाजवत सुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvāvad vājavat sutaḥ ||
Translation: In kine and gold and steeds and spoil.

Sanskit Text: स पवस्व विचर्षण आ मही रोदसी पर्ण |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pavasva vicarṣaṇa ā mahī rodasī pṛṇa |
Translation: 5 Flow on thy way, Most Active, thou. fill full the mighty heavens and earth,

Sanskit Text: उषाः सूर्यो न रश्मिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣāḥ sūryo na raśmibhiḥ ||
Translation: As Dawn, as Sūrya with his beams.

Sanskit Text: परि णः शर्मयन्त्या धारया सोम विश्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari ṇaḥ śarmayantyā dhārayā soma viśvataḥ |
Translation: 6 On every side, O Soma, flow round us with thy protecting stream,

Sanskit Text: सरा रसेव विष्टपम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarā raseva viṣṭapam ||
Translation: As Rasā flows around the world.

Sanskit Text: जनयन रोचना दिवो जनयन्नप्सु सूर्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: janayan rocanā divo janayannapsu sūryam |
Translation: 1. ENGENDERING the Sun in floods, engendering heaven's lights, green-hued,

Sanskit Text: वसानो गा अपोहरिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasāno ghā apohariḥ ||
Translation: Robed in the waters and the milk,

Sanskit Text: एष परत्नेन मन्मना देवो देवेभ्यस परि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa pratnena manmanā devo devebhyas pari |
Translation: 2 According to primeval plan this Soma, with his stream, effused

Sanskit Text: धारया पवते सुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhārayā pavate sutaḥ ||
Translation: Flows purely on, a God for Gods.

Sanskit Text: वाव्र्धानाय तूर्वये पवन्ते वाजसातये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāvṛdhānāya tūrvaye pavante vājasātaye |
Translation: 3 For him victorious, waxen great, the juices with a thousand powers

Sanskit Text: सोमाः सहस्रपाजसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somāḥ sahasrapājasaḥ ||
Translation: Are purified for winning spoil.

Sanskit Text: दुहानः परत्नमित पयः पवित्रे परि षिच्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: duhānaḥ pratnamit payaḥ pavitre pari ṣicyate |
Translation: 4 Shedding the ancient fluid he is poured into the cleansing sieve:

Sanskit Text: करन्दन देवानजीजनत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: krandan devānajījanat ||
Translation: He, thundering, hath produced the Gods.

Sanskit Text: अभि विश्वानि वार्याभि देवान रताव्र्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi viśvāni vāryābhi devān ṛtāvṛdhaḥ |
Translation: 5 Soma, while purifying, sends hither all things to be desired,

Sanskit Text: सोमः पुनानोर्षति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaḥ punānoarṣati ||
Translation: He sends the Gods who strengthen Law.

Sanskit Text: गोमन नः सोम वीरवदश्वावद वाजवत सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghoman naḥ soma vīravadaśvāvad vājavat sutaḥ |
Translation: 6 Soma, effused, pour on us wealth in kine, in heroes, steeds, and spoil,

Sanskit Text: पवस्व बर्हतीरिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva bṛhatīriṣaḥ ||
Translation: Send us abundant store of food.

Sanskit Text: यो अत्य इव मर्ज्यते गोभिर्मदाय हर्यतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo atya iva mṛjyate ghobhirmadāya haryataḥ |
Translation: 1. WE will enrobe with sacred song the Lovely One who, as a Steed,

Sanskit Text: तं गीर्भिर्वासयामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ ghīrbhirvāsayāmasi ||
Translation: Is decked with milk for rapturous joy.

Sanskit Text: तं नो विश्वा अवस्युवो गिरः शुम्भन्ति पूर्वथा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ no viśvā avasyuvo ghiraḥ śumbhanti pūrvathā |
Translation: 2 All songs of ours desiring grace adorn him in the ancient way,

Sanskit Text: इन्दुमिन्द्राय पीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indumindrāya pītaye ||
Translation: Indu for Indra, for his drink.

Sanskit Text: पुनानो याति हर्यतः सोमो गीर्भिः परिष्क्र्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: punāno yāti haryataḥ somo ghīrbhiḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ |
Translation: 3 Soma flows on when purified, beloved and adorned with songs,

Sanskit Text: विप्रस्य मेध्यातिथेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viprasya medhyātitheḥ ||
Translation: Songs of the sage Medhyātithi.

Sanskit Text: पवमान विदा रयिमस्मभ्यं सोम सुश्रियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamāna vidā rayimasmabhyaṃ soma suśriyam |
Translation: 4 O Soma Pavamana, find exceeding glorious wealth for us,

Sanskit Text: इन्दो सहस्रवर्चसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indo sahasravarcasam ||
Translation: Wealth, Indu, fraught with boundless might.
