Sanskit Text: इन्दुरत्यो न वाजस्र्त कनिक्रन्ति पवित्र आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: induratyo na vājasṛt kanikranti pavitra ā |
Translation: 5 Like courser racing to the prize Indu, the lover of the Gods,

Sanskit Text: यदक्षारति देवयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadakṣārati devayuḥ ||
Translation: Roars, as he passes, in the sieve.

Sanskit Text: पवस्व वाजसातये विप्रस्य गर्णतो वर्धे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva vājasātaye viprasya ghṛṇato vṛdhe |
Translation: 6 Flow on thy way to win us strength, to speed the sage who praises thee:

Sanskit Text: सोम रास्व सुवीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: soma rāsva suvīryam ||
Translation: Soma, bestow heroic power.

Sanskit Text: पर ण इन्दो महे तन ऊर्मिं न बिभ्रदर्षसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ṇa indo mahe tana ūrmiṃ na bibhradarṣasi |
Translation: 1. INDU, to us for this great rite, bearing as ’twere thy wave to Gods,

Sanskit Text: अभि देवानयास्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi devānayāsyaḥ ||
Translation: Unwearied, thou art flowing forQh.

Sanskit Text: मती जुष्टो धिया हितः सोमो हिन्वे परावति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: matī juṣṭo dhiyā hitaḥ somo hinve parāvati |
Translation: 2 Pleased with the hymn, impelled by prayer, Soma is hurried far away,

Sanskit Text: विप्रस्य धारया कविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viprasya dhārayā kaviḥ ||
Translation: The Wise One in the Singer's stream.,

Sanskit Text: अयं देवेषु जाग्र्विः सुत एति पवित्र आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ deveṣu jāghṛviḥ suta eti pavitra ā |
Translation: 3 Watchful among the. gods, this juice advances to the cleansing sieve

Sanskit Text: सोमो याति विचर्षणिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somo yāti vicarṣaṇiḥ ||
Translation: Soma, most active, travels on.

Sanskit Text: स नः पवस्व वाजयुश्चक्राणश्चारुमध्वरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ pavasva vājayuścakrāṇaścārumadhvaram |
Translation: 4 Flow onward, seeking strength for us, embellishing the sacrifice:

Sanskit Text: बर्हिष्माना विवासति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: barhiṣmānā vivāsati ||
Translation: The priest with trimmed grass calleth thee.

Sanskit Text: स नो भगाय वायवे विप्रवीरः सदाव्र्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no bhaghāya vāyave vipravīraḥ sadāvṛdhaḥ |
Translation: 5 May Soma, ever bringing power to Bhaga and to Vāyu, Sage

Sanskit Text: सोमो देवेष्वा यमत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somo deveṣvā yamat ||
Translation: And Hero, lead us to the Gods.

Sanskit Text: स नो अद्य वसुत्तये करतुविद गातुवित्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no adya vasuttaye kratuvid ghātuvittamaḥ |
Translation: 6 So, to increase our wealth to-day, Inspirer, best of Furtherers,

Sanskit Text: वाजं जेषि शरवो बर्हत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājaṃ jeṣi śravo bṛhat ||
Translation: Win for us strength and high renown.

Sanskit Text: स पवस्व मदाय कं नर्चक्षा देववीतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pavasva madāya kaṃ nṛcakṣā devavītaye |
Translation: 1. FLOW, thou who viewest men, to give delight, to entertain the Gods,

Sanskit Text: इन्दविन्द्रायपीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indavindrāyapītaye ||
Translation: Indu, to Indra for his drink.

Sanskit Text: स नो अर्षाभि दूत्यं तवमिन्द्राय तोशसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no arṣābhi dūtyaṃ tvamindrāya tośase |
Translation: 2 Stream to thine embassy for us: thou hastenest, for Indra, to

Sanskit Text: देवान सखिभ्य आ वरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devān sakhibhya ā varam ||
Translation: The Gods, O better than our friends.

Sanskit Text: उत तवामरुणं वयं गोभिरञ्ज्मो मदाय कम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tvāmaruṇaṃ vayaṃ ghobhirañjmo madāya kam |
Translation: 3 We balm thee, red of hue, with milk to fit thee for the rapturous joy:

Sanskit Text: वि नो राये दुरो वर्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi no rāye duro vṛdhi ||
Translation: Unbar for us the doors of wealth.

Sanskit Text: अत्यू पवित्रमक्रमीद वाजी धुरं न यामनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atyū pavitramakramīd vājī dhuraṃ na yāmani |
Translation: 4 He through the sieve hath passed, as comes a courser to the pole, to run

Sanskit Text: इन्दुर्देवेषु पत्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indurdeveṣu patyate ||
Translation: Indu belongs unto the Gods.

Sanskit Text: समी सखायो अस्वरन वने करीळन्तमत्यविम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samī sakhāyo asvaran vane krīḷantamatyavim |
Translation: 5 All friends have lauded him as he sports in the wood, beyond the fleece:

Sanskit Text: इन्दुं नावा अनूषत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: induṃ nāvā anūṣata ||
Translation: Singers have chanted Indu's praise.

Sanskit Text: तया पवस्व धारया यया पीतो विचक्षसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tayā pavasva dhārayā yayā pīto vicakṣase |
Translation: 6 Flow, Indu, with that stream wherein steeped thou announcest to the man

Sanskit Text: इन्दो सतोत्रे सुवीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indo stotre suvīryam ||
Translation: Who worships thee heroic strength.

Sanskit Text: अया सोमः सुक्र्त्यया महश्चिदभ्यवर्धत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayā somaḥ sukṛtyayā mahaścidabhyavardhata |
Translation: 1. GREAT as he was, Soma hath gained strength by this high solemnity:

Sanskit Text: मन्दान उद्व्र्षायते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mandāna udvṛṣāyate ||
Translation: joyous he riseth like a bull.

Sanskit Text: कर्तानीदस्य कर्त्वा चेतन्ते दस्युतर्हणा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛtānīdasya kartvā cetante dasyutarhaṇā |
Translation: 2 His task is done: his crushings of the Dasyus are made manifest:

Sanskit Text: रणा च धर्ष्णुश्चयते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṇā ca dhṛṣṇuścayate ||
Translation: He sternly reckoneth their debts.

Sanskit Text: आत सोम इन्द्रियो रसो वज्रः सहस्रसा भुवत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āt soma indriyo raso vajraḥ sahasrasā bhuvat |
Translation: 3 Soon as his song of praise is born, the Soma, Indra's juice, becomes

Sanskit Text: उक्थं यदस्य जायते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukthaṃ yadasya jāyate ||
Translation: A thousand-winning thunderbolt.

Sanskit Text: सवयं कविर्विधर्तरि विप्राय रत्नमिछति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svayaṃ kavirvidhartari viprāya ratnamichati |
Translation: 4 Seer and Sustainer, he himself desireth riches for the sage

Sanskit Text: यदी मर्म्र्ज्यते धियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadī marmṛjyate dhiyaḥ ||
Translation: When he embellisheth his songs.

Sanskit Text: सिषासतू रयीणां वाजेष्वर्वतामिव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: siṣāsatū rayīṇāṃ vājeṣvarvatāmiva |
Translation: 5 Fain would they both win riches as in races of the steeds. In war

Sanskit Text: भरेषु जिग्युषामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhareṣu jighyuṣāmasi ||
Translation: Thou art upon the conquerors' side.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा नर्म्णानि बिभ्रतं सधस्थेषु महो दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā nṛmṇāni bibhrataṃ sadhastheṣu maho divaḥ |
Translation: 1. WITH sacrifice we seek to thee kind Cherisher of manly might

Sanskit Text: चारुं सुक्र्त्ययेमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cāruṃ sukṛtyayemahe ||
Translation: In mansions of the lofty heavens;

Sanskit Text: संव्र्क्तध्र्ष्णुमुक्थ्यं महामहिव्रतं मदम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃvṛktadhṛṣṇumukthyaṃ mahāmahivrataṃ madam |
Translation: 2 Gladdening crusher of the bold, ruling with very mighty sway,

Sanskit Text: शतं पुरो रुरुक्षणिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ puro rurukṣaṇim ||
Translation: Destroyer of a hundred forts.

Sanskit Text: अतस्त्वा रयिमभि राजानं सुक्रतो दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atastvā rayimabhi rājānaṃ sukrato divaḥ |
Translation: 3 Hence, Sapient One! the Falcon, strong of wing, unwearied, brought thee down,

Sanskit Text: सुपर्णो अव्यथिर्भरत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suparṇo avyathirbharat ||
Translation: Lord over riches, from the sky.

Sanskit Text: विश्वस्मा इत सवर्द्र्शे साधारणं रजस्तुरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvasmā it svardṛśe sādhāraṇaṃ rajasturam |
Translation: 4 That each may see the light, the Bird brought us the guard of Law, the Friend

Sanskit Text: गोपां रतस्य विर्भरत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghopāṃ ṛtasya virbharat ||
Translation: Of all, the speeder through the air.

Sanskit Text: अधा हिन्वान इन्द्रियं जयायो महित्वमानशे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā hinvāna indriyaṃ jyāyo mahitvamānaśe |
Translation: 5 And now, sent forth, it hath attained to mighty power and majesty,

Sanskit Text: अभिष्टिक्र्द्विचर्षणिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhiṣṭikṛdvicarṣaṇiḥ ||
Translation: Most active, ready to assist.

Sanskit Text: पवस्व वर्ष्टिमा सु नो.अपामूर्मिं दिवस परि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva vṛṣṭimā su no.apāmūrmiṃ divas pari |
Translation: 1. Poust down the rain upon us, pour a wave of waters from the sky,

Sanskit Text: अयक्ष्मा बर्हतीरिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayakṣmā bṛhatīriṣaḥ ||
Translation: And plenteous store of wholesome fbod.

Sanskit Text: तया पवस्व धारया यया गाव इहागमन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tayā pavasva dhārayā yayā ghāva ihāghaman |
Translation: 2 Flow onward with that stream of thine, whereby the cows have come to us,

Sanskit Text: जन्यास उप नो गर्हम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: janyāsa upa no ghṛham ||
Translation: The kine of strangers to our home.

Sanskit Text: घर्तं पवस्व धारया यज्ञेषु देववीतमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtaṃ pavasva dhārayā yajñeṣu devavītamaḥ |
Translation: 3 Chief Friend of Gods in sacred rites, pour on us fatness with thy stream,

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं वर्ष्टिमा पव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ vṛṣṭimā pava ||
Translation: Ppur down on us a flood of rain.

Sanskit Text: स न ऊर्जे वयव्ययं पवित्रं धाव धारया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa na ūrje vyavyayaṃ pavitraṃ dhāva dhārayā |
Translation: 4 To give us vigour, with thy stream run through the fleecy straining-cloth

Sanskit Text: देवासः शर्णवन हि कम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāsaḥ śṛṇavan hi kam ||
Translation: For verily the Gods will bear.

Sanskit Text: पवमानो असिष्यदद रक्षांस्यपजङघनत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamāno asiṣyadad rakṣāṃsyapajaṅghanat |
Translation: 5 Onward hath Pavamana flowed and beaten off the Rākṣasas,

Sanskit Text: परत्नवद रोचयन रुचः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratnavad rocayan rucaḥ ||
Translation: Flashing out splendour as of old.

Sanskit Text: उत ते शुष्मास ईरते सिन्धोरूर्मेरिव सवनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut te śuṣmāsa īrate sindhorūrmeriva svanaḥ |
Translation: 1. LOUD as a river's roaring wave thy powers have lifted up themselves:

Sanskit Text: वाणस्य चोदया पविम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāṇasya codayā pavim ||
Translation: Urge on thine arrow's sharpened point.

Sanskit Text: परसवे त उदीरते तिस्रो वाचो मखस्युवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prasave ta udīrate tisro vāco makhasyuvaḥ |
Translation: 2 At thine effusion upward rise three voices full of joy, when thou

Sanskit Text: यदव्य एषिसानवि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadavya eṣisānavi ||
Translation: Flowest upon the fleecy ridge.

Sanskit Text: अव्यो वारे परि परियं हरिं हिन्वन्त्यद्रिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avyo vāre pari priyaṃ hariṃ hinvantyadribhiḥ |
Translation: 3 On to the fleece they urge with stone the tawny well-beloved One,

Sanskit Text: पवमानम्मधुश्चुतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamānammadhuścutam ||
Translation: Even Pavamana, dropping meath.

Sanskit Text: आ पवस्व मदिन्तम पवित्रं धारया कवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā pavasva madintama pavitraṃ dhārayā kave |
Translation: 4 Flow with thy current to the sieve, O Sage most powerful to cheer,

Sanskit Text: अर्कस्य योनिमासदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arkasya yonimāsadam ||
Translation: To seat thee in the place of song.

Sanskit Text: स पवस्व मदिन्तम गोभिरञ्जानो अक्तुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pavasva madintama ghobhirañjāno aktubhiḥ |
Translation: 5 Flow, Most Exhilarating! flow anointed with the milk for balm,

Sanskit Text: इन्दविन्द्रायपीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indavindrāyapītaye ||
Translation: Indu, for Indra, for his drink.

Sanskit Text: अध्वर्यो अद्रिभिः सुतं सोमं पवित्र आ सर्ज |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhvaryo adribhiḥ sutaṃ somaṃ pavitra ā sṛja |
Translation: 1. ADHVARYU, on the filter pour the Soma juice expressed with stones,

Sanskit Text: पुनीहीन्द्राय पातवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punīhīndrāya pātave ||
Translation: And make it pure for Indra's drink.

Sanskit Text: दिवः पीयूषमुत्तमं सोममिन्द्राय वज्रिणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divaḥ pīyūṣamuttamaṃ somamindrāya vajriṇe |
Translation: 2 Pour out for Indra, Thunder-armed, the milk of heaven,, the Soma's juice,

Sanskit Text: सुनोता मधुमत्तमम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sunotā madhumattamam ||
Translation: Most excellent, most rich in sweets.

Sanskit Text: तव तय इन्दो अन्धसो देवा मधोर्व्यश्नते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava tya indo andhaso devā madhorvyaśnate |
Translation: 3 These Gods and all the Marut host, Indu enjoy this juice of thine,

Sanskit Text: पवमानस्य मरुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamānasya marutaḥ ||
Translation: This Pavamana's flowing meath.

Sanskit Text: तवं हि सोम वर्धयन सुतो मदाय भूर्णये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hi soma vardhayan suto madāya bhūrṇaye |
Translation: 4 For, Soma, thou hast been effused, strengthening for the wild carouse,

Sanskit Text: वर्षन सतोतारमूतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣan stotāramūtaye ||
Translation: O Steer, the singer, for our help.

Sanskit Text: अभ्यर्ष विचक्षण पवित्रं धारया सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhyarṣa vicakṣaṇa pavitraṃ dhārayā sutaḥ |
Translation: 5 Flow with thy stream, Far-sighted One, effused, into the cleansing sieve:

Sanskit Text: अभि वाजमुत शरवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi vājamuta śravaḥ ||
Translation: Flow on to give us strength and fame.

Sanskit Text: परि दयुक्षः सनद्रयिर्भरद वाजं नो अन्धसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari dyukṣaḥ sanadrayirbharad vājaṃ no andhasā |
Translation: 1. WEALTH-WINNER, dwelling in the sky, bringing us vigour with the juice,

Sanskit Text: सुवानोर्ष पवित्र आ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvānoarṣa pavitra ā ||
Translation: Flow to the filter when effused.

Sanskit Text: तव परत्नेभिरध्वभिरव्यो वारे परि परियः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava pratnebhiradhvabhiravyo vāre pari priyaḥ |
Translation: 2 So, in thine ancient ways, may he, beloved, with a thousand streams

Sanskit Text: सहस्रधारो यात तना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasradhāro yāt tanā ||
Translation: Run o’er the fleecy straining-cloth.

Sanskit Text: चरुर्न यस्तमीङखयेन्दो न दानमीङखय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: carurna yastamīṅkhayendo na dānamīṅkhaya |
Translation: 3 Him who is like a caldron shake: O Indu, shake thy gift to us

Sanskit Text: वधैर्वधस्नवीङखय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vadhairvadhasnavīṅkhaya ||
Translation: Shake it, armed Warrior! with thine arms.

Sanskit Text: नि शुष्ममिन्दवेषां पुरुहूत जनानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni śuṣmamindaveṣāṃ puruhūta janānām |
Translation: 4 Indu, invoked with many a prayer, bring down the vigour of these men,

Sanskit Text: यो अस्मानादिदेशति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo asmānādideśati ||
Translation: Of him who threatens us with war.

Sanskit Text: शतं न इन्द ऊतिभिः सहस्रं वा शुचीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ na inda ūtibhiḥ sahasraṃ vā śucīnām |
Translation: 5 Indu, Wealth-giver, with thine help pour out for us a hundred, yea,

Sanskit Text: पवस्व मंहयद्रयिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva maṃhayadrayiḥ ||
Translation: A thousand of thy pure bright streams.

Sanskit Text: उत ते शुष्मासो अस्थू रक्षो भिन्दन्तो अद्रिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut te śuṣmāso asthū rakṣo bhindanto adrivaḥ |
Translation: 1. O THOU with stones for arms, thy powers, crushing the fiends, have raised themselves:

Sanskit Text: नुदस्व याः परिस्प्र्धः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nudasva yāḥ parispṛdhaḥ ||
Translation: Chase thou the foes who compass us.

Sanskit Text: अया निजघ्निरोजसा रथसंगे धने हिते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayā nijaghnirojasā rathasaṃghe dhane hite |
Translation: 2 Thou conquerest thus with might when car meets car, and when the prize is staked:

Sanskit Text: सतवा अबिभ्युषा हर्दा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stavā abibhyuṣā hṛdā ||
Translation: With fearless heart will I sing praise.

Sanskit Text: अस्य वरतानि नाध्र्षे पवमानस्य दूढ्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya vratāni nādhṛṣe pavamānasya dūḍhyā |
Translation: 3 No one with evil thought assails this Pavamana's holy laws:

Sanskit Text: रुज यस्त्वाप्र्तन्यति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ruja yastvāpṛtanyati ||
Translation: Crush him who fain would fight with thee.

Sanskit Text: तं हिन्वन्ति मदच्युतं हरिं नदीषु वाजिनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ hinvanti madacyutaṃ hariṃ nadīṣu vājinam |
Translation: 4 For Indra to the streams they drive the tawny rapture-dropping Steed,

Sanskit Text: इन्दुमिन्द्राय मत्सरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indumindrāya matsaram ||
Translation: Indu the bringer of delight.

Sanskit Text: अस्य परत्नामनु दयुतं शुक्रं दुदुह्रे अह्रयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya pratnāmanu dyutaṃ śukraṃ duduhre ahrayaḥ |
Translation: 1. AFTER his ancient splendour, they, the bold, have drawn the bright milk from

Sanskit Text: पयः सहस्रसां रषिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: payaḥ sahasrasāṃ ṛṣim ||
Translation: The Sage who wins a thousand gifts.

Sanskit Text: अयं सूर्य इवोपद्र्गयं सरांसि धावति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ sūrya ivopadṛghayaṃ sarāṃsi dhāvati |
Translation: 2 In aspect he is like the Sun; he runneth forward to the lakes,

Sanskit Text: सप्त परवता दिवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sapta pravataā divam ||
Translation: Seven currents flowing through the sky.

Sanskit Text: अयं विश्वानि तिष्ठति पुनानो भुवनोपरि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ viśvāni tiṣṭhati punāno bhuvanopari |
Translation: 3 He, shining in his splendour, stands high over all things that exist-

Sanskit Text: सोमो देवो नसूर्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somo devo nasūryaḥ ||
Translation: Soma, a God as Sūrya is.

Sanskit Text: परि णो देववीतये वाजानर्षसि गोमतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari ṇo devavītaye vājānarṣasi ghomataḥ |
Translation: 4 Thou, Indu, in thy brilliancy, pourest on us, as Indra's Friend,

Sanskit Text: पुनान इन्दविन्द्रयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punāna indavindrayuḥ ||
Translation: Wealth from the kine to feast the Gods.

Sanskit Text: यवं-यवं नो अन्धसा पुष्टम-पुष्टं परि सरव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yavaṃ-yavaṃ no andhasā puṣṭam-puṣṭaṃ pari srava |
Translation: 1. POUR on us with thy juice all kinds of corn, each sort of nourishment,

Sanskit Text: सोम विश्वा च सौभगा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: soma viśvā ca saubhaghā ||
Translation: And, Soma, all felicities.

Sanskit Text: ईन्दो यथा तव सतवो यथा ते जातमन्धसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īndo yathā tava stavo yathā te jātamandhasaḥ |
Translation: 2 As thine, O Indu, is the praise, and thine what springeth from the juice,

Sanskit Text: नि बर्हिषि परिये सदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni barhiṣi priye sadaḥ ||
Translation: Seat thee on the dear sacred grass.

Sanskit Text: उत नो गोविदश्ववित पवस्व सोमान्धसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta no ghovidaśvavit pavasva somāndhasā |
Translation: 3 And, finding for us kine and steeds, O Soma, with thy juice flow on

Sanskit Text: मक्षूतमेभिरहभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: makṣūtamebhirahabhiḥ ||
Translation: Through days that fly most rapidly.

Sanskit Text: यो जिनाति न जीयते हन्ति शत्रुमभीत्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo jināti na jīyate hanti śatrumabhītya |
Translation: 4 As one who conquers, ne’er subdued, attacks and stays the enemy,

Sanskit Text: स पवस्व सहस्रजित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pavasva sahasrajit ||
Translation: Thus, Vanquisher of thousands! flow.

Sanskit Text: परि सोम रतं बर्हदाशुः पवित्रे अर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari soma ṛtaṃ bṛhadāśuḥ pavitre arṣati |
Translation: 1. SWIFT to the purifying sieve flows Soma as exalted Law,

Sanskit Text: विघ्नन रक्षांसि देवयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vighnan rakṣāṃsi devayuḥ ||
Translation: Slaying the fiends, loving the Gods.

Sanskit Text: यत सोमो वाजमर्षति शतं धारा अपस्युवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat somo vājamarṣati śataṃ dhārā apasyuvaḥ |
Translation: 2 When Soma pours the strengthening food a hundred ever-active streams

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्यसख्यमाविशन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasyasakhyamāviśan ||
Translation: To Indra's friendship win theirway.

Sanskit Text: अभि तवा योषणो दश जारं न कन्यानूषत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tvā yoṣaṇo daśa jāraṃ na kanyānūṣata |
Translation: 3 Ten Dames have sung to welcome thee, even as a maiden greets her love:

Sanskit Text: मर्ज्यसे सोम सातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mṛjyase soma sātaye ||
Translation: O Soma, thou art decked to win.

Sanskit Text: तवमिन्द्राय विष्णवे सवादुरिन्दो परि सरव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamindrāya viṣṇave svādurindo pari srava |
Translation: 4 Flow hitherward, O Indu, sweet to Indra and to Viṣṇu: guard

Sanskit Text: नॄन सतोतॄन्पाह्यंहसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṝn stotṝnpāhyaṃhasaḥ ||
Translation: The men, the singers, from distress.

Sanskit Text: पर ते धारा असश्चतो दिवो न यन्ति वर्ष्टयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te dhārā asaścato divo na yanti vṛṣṭayaḥ |
Translation: 1. THY streams that never fail or waste flow forth like showers of rain from heaven,

Sanskit Text: अछा वाजं सहस्रिणम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā vājaṃ sahasriṇam ||
Translation: To bring a thousand stores of strength.

Sanskit Text: अभि परियाणि काव्या विश्वा चक्षाणो अर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi priyāṇi kāvyā viśvā cakṣāṇo arṣati |
Translation: 2 He flows beholding on his way all wellbeloved sacred lore,

Sanskit Text: हरिस्तुञ्जान आयुधा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: haristuñjāna āyudhā ||
Translation: Green-tinted, brandishing his, arms.

Sanskit Text: स मर्म्र्जान आयुभिरिभो राजेव सुव्रतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa marmṛjāna āyubhiribho rājeva suvrataḥ |
Translation: 3 He, when the people deck him like a docile king of elephants.

Sanskit Text: शयेनो न वंसु षीदति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śyeno na vaṃsu ṣīdati ||
Translation: Sits as a falcon in the, wood.

Sanskit Text: स नो विश्वा दिवो वसूतो पर्थिव्या अधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no viśvā divo vasūto pṛthivyā adhi |
Translation: 4 So bring thou hitherward to us, Indu, while thou art purified,

Sanskit Text: पुनान इन्दवाभर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punāna indavābhara ||
Translation: All treasures both of heaven and earth.

Sanskit Text: तरत स मन्दी धावति धारा सुतस्यान्धसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tarat sa mandī dhāvati dhārā sutasyāndhasaḥ |
Translation: 1. SWIFT runs this giver of delight, even the stream of flowing juice:

Sanskit Text: तरत स मन्दी धावति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tarat sa mandī dhāvati ||
Translation: Swift runs this giver of delight.

Sanskit Text: उस्रा वेद वसूनां मर्तस्य देव्यवसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: usrā veda vasūnāṃ martasya devyavasaḥ |
Translation: 2 The Morning knows all precious things, the Goddess knows her grace to man:

Sanskit Text: तरत स मन्दी धावति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tarat sa mandī dhāvati ||
Translation: Swift runs this giver of delight.

Sanskit Text: धवस्रयोः पुरुषन्त्योरा सहस्राणि दद्महे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhvasrayoḥ puruṣantyorā sahasrāṇi dadmahe |
Translation: 3 We have accepted thousands from Dhvasra's and Puruṣanti's hands:

Sanskit Text: तरत स मन्दी धावति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tarat sa mandī dhāvati ||
Translation: Swift runs this giver of delight.

Sanskit Text: आ ययोस्त्रिंशतं तना सहस्राणि च दद्महे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yayostriṃśataṃ tanā sahasrāṇi ca dadmahe |
Translation: 4 From whom we have accepted thus thousands and three times ten beside:

Sanskit Text: तरत समन्दी धावति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tarat samandī dhāvati ||
Translation: Swift runs this giver of delight.

Sanskit Text: पवस्व गोजिदश्वजिद विश्वजित सोम रण्यजित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva ghojidaśvajid viśvajit soma raṇyajit |
Translation: 1. FLOW onward, Soma, winning kine, and steeds, and all that gives delight:

Sanskit Text: परजावद रत्नमा भर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prajāvad ratnamā bhara ||
Translation: Bring hither wealth with progeny.

Sanskit Text: पवस्वाद्भ्यो अदाभ्यः पवस्वौषधीभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasvādbhyo adābhyaḥ pavasvauṣadhībhyaḥ |
Translation: 2 Flow onward from the waters, flow, inviolable, from the plants:

Sanskit Text: पवस्व धिषणाभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva dhiṣaṇābhyaḥ ||
Translation: Flow onward from the pressing-boards.

Sanskit Text: तवं सोम पवमानो विश्वानि दुरिता तर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ soma pavamāno viśvāni duritā tara |
Translation: 3 Soma, as Pavamana, pass over all trouble and distress:

Sanskit Text: कविः सीद नि बर्हिषि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaviḥ sīda ni barhiṣi ||
Translation: Sit on the sacred grass, a Sage.

Sanskit Text: पवमान सवर्विदो जायमानो.अभवो महान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamāna svarvido jāyamāno.abhavo mahān |
Translation: 4 Thou, Pavamana, foundest light; thou at thy birth becamest great:

Sanskit Text: इन्दो विश्वानभीदसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indo viśvānabhīdasi ||
Translation: O Indu, thou art over all.

Sanskit Text: पर गायत्रेण गायत पवमानं विचर्षणिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ghāyatreṇa ghāyata pavamānaṃ vicarṣaṇim |
Translation: 1. SING forth and laud with sacred song most active Pavamana, laud

Sanskit Text: इन्दुं सहस्रचक्षसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: induṃ sahasracakṣasam ||
Translation: Indu who sees with thousand eyes.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा सहस्रचक्षसमथो सहस्रभर्णसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā sahasracakṣasamatho sahasrabharṇasam |
Translation: 2 Thee who hast thousand eyes to see, bearer of thousand burthens, they

Sanskit Text: अति वारमपाविषुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ati vāramapāviṣuḥ ||
Translation: Have filtered through the fleecy cloth.

Sanskit Text: अति वारान पवमानो असिष्यदत कलशानभि धावति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ati vārān pavamāno asiṣyadat kalaśānabhi dhāvati |
Translation: 3 He, Pavamana, hath streamed through the fleece then: he runs into the jars,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य हार्द्याविशन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya hārdyāviśan ||
Translation: Finding his way to Indra's heart.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य सोम राधसे शं पवस्व विचर्षणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya soma rādhase śaṃ pavasva vicarṣaṇe |
Translation: 4 That Indra may be bounteous, flow, most active Soma, for our weal:

Sanskit Text: परजावद रेता भर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prajāvad retaā bhara ||
Translation: Bring genial seed with progeny.

Sanskit Text: हिन्वन्ति सूरमुस्रयः सवसारो जामयस पतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hinvanti sūramusrayaḥ svasāro jāmayas patim |
Translation: 1. THE, glittering maids send Sūra forth, the glorious sisters, close-allied,

Sanskit Text: महामिन्दुं महीयुवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahāminduṃ mahīyuvaḥ ||
Translation: Send Indu forth, their mighty Lord.

Sanskit Text: पवमान रुचा-रुचा देवो देवेभ्यस परि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamāna rucā-rucā devo devebhyas pari |
Translation: 2 Pervade, O Pavamana, all our treasures with repeated light,

Sanskit Text: विश्वा वसून्याविश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā vasūnyāviśa ||
Translation: God, coming hither from the Gods.

Sanskit Text: आ पवमान सुष्टुतिं वर्ष्टिं देवेभ्यो दुवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā pavamāna suṣṭutiṃ vṛṣṭiṃ devebhyo duvaḥ |
Translation: 3 Pour on us, Pavamana, rain, as service and rain praise for Gods:

Sanskit Text: इषे पवस्व संयतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣe pavasva saṃyatam ||
Translation: Pour all to be our nourishment.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा हयसि भानुना दयुमन्तं तवा हवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā hyasi bhānunā dyumantaṃ tvā havāmahe |
Translation: 4 Thou art a Steer by lustre: we, O Pavamana, faithfully

Sanskit Text: पवमान सवाध्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamāna svādhyaḥ ||
Translation: Call upon thee the Splendid One.

Sanskit Text: आ पवस्व सुवीर्यं मन्दमानः सवायुध |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā pavasva suvīryaṃ mandamānaḥ svāyudha |
Translation: 5 Do thou, rejoicing, nobly-armed! pour upon us heroic strength:

Sanskit Text: इहो षविन्दवा गहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iho ṣvindavā ghahi ||
Translation: O Indu, come thou bitherward.

Sanskit Text: यदद्भिः परिषिच्यसे मर्ज्यमानो गभस्त्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadadbhiḥ pariṣicyase mṛjyamāno ghabhastyoḥ |
Translation: 6 When thou art cleansed with both the hands and dipped in waters, with the wood.

Sanskit Text: दरुणा सधस्थमश्नुषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: druṇā sadhasthamaśnuṣe ||
Translation: Thou comest to the gathering-place.

Sanskit Text: पर सोमाय वयश्ववत पवमानाय गायत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra somāya vyaśvavat pavamānāya ghāyata |
Translation: 7 Sing forth your songs, as Vyaśva sang, to Soma Pavamana, to,

Sanskit Text: महे सहस्रचक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahe sahasracakṣase ||
Translation: The Mighty One with thousand eyes;

Sanskit Text: यस्य वर्णं मधुश्चुतं हरिं हिन्वन्त्यद्रिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya varṇaṃ madhuścutaṃ hariṃ hinvantyadribhiḥ |
Translation: 8 Whose coloured sap they drive with stones, the yellow meath-distilling juice,

Sanskit Text: इन्दुमिन्द्राय पीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indumindrāya pītaye ||
Translation: Indu for Indra, for his drink.

Sanskit Text: तस्य ते वाजिनो वयं विश्वा धनानि जिग्युषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya te vājino vayaṃ viśvā dhanāni jighyuṣaḥ |
Translation: 9 We seek to gain the friendly love of thee that Strong and Mighty One,

Sanskit Text: सखित्वमा वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhitvamā vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: Of thee the winner of all wealth.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा पवस्व धारया मरुत्वते च मत्सरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā pavasva dhārayā marutvate ca matsaraḥ |
Translation: 10 Flow onward with thy stream, a Steer, inspiriting the Maruts’ Lord,

Sanskit Text: विश्वा दधान ओजसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā dadhāna ojasā ||
Translation: Winning all riches by thy might.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा धर्तारमोण्योः पवमान सवर्द्र्शम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā dhartāramoṇyoḥ pavamāna svardṛśam |
Translation: 11 I send thee forth to battle from the press, O Pavamana, Strong,

Sanskit Text: हिन्वे वाजेषु वाजिनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hinve vājeṣu vājinam ||
Translation: Sustainer, looker on the light.

Sanskit Text: अया चित्तो विपानया हरिः पवस्व धारया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayā citto vipānayā hariḥ pavasva dhārayā |
Translation: 12 Acknowledged by this song of mine, flow, tawny-coloured, with thy stream

Sanskit Text: युजं वाजेषु चोदय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yujaṃ vājeṣu codaya ||
Translation: Incite to battle thine ally.

Sanskit Text: आ न इन्दो महीमिषं पवस्व विश्वदर्शतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā na indo mahīmiṣaṃ pavasva viśvadarśataḥ |
Translation: 13 O Indu, visible to all pour out for us abundant food:

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं सोम गातुवित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ soma ghātuvit ||
Translation: Soma, be thou our prosperer.

Sanskit Text: आ कलशा अनूषतेन्दो धाराभिरोजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā kalaśā anūṣatendo dhārābhirojasā |
Translation: 14 The pitchers, Indu, with thy streams have sung aloud in vigorous might

Sanskit Text: एन्द्रस्य पीतयेविश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: endrasya pītayeviśa ||
Translation: Enter them, and let Indra drink.

Sanskit Text: यस्य ते मद्यं रसं तीव्रं दुहन्त्यद्रिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya te madyaṃ rasaṃ tīvraṃ duhantyadribhiḥ |
Translation: 15 O thou whose potent gladdening juice they milk out with the stones, flow on,

Sanskit Text: स पवस्वाभिमातिहा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pavasvābhimātihā ||
Translation: Destroyer of our enemies.

Sanskit Text: राजा मेधाभिरीयते पवमानो मनावधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājā medhābhirīyate pavamāno manāvadhi |
Translation: 16 King Pavamana is implored with holy songs, on man's behalf,

Sanskit Text: अन्तरिक्षेण यातवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: antarikṣeṇa yātave ||
Translation: To travel through the firmament.

Sanskit Text: आ न इन्दो शतग्विनं गवां पोषं सवश्व्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā na indo śataghvinaṃ ghavāṃ poṣaṃ svaśvyam |
Translation: 17 Bring us, O Indu, hundredfold increase of kine, and noble steeds,

Sanskit Text: वहा भगत्तिमूतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vahā bhaghattimūtaye ||
Translation: The gift of fortune for our help.

Sanskit Text: आ नः सोम सहो जुवो रूपं न वर्चसे भर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā naḥ soma saho juvo rūpaṃ na varcase bhara |
Translation: 18 Pressed for the banquet of the Gods, O Soma, bring us might, and speed,

Sanskit Text: सुष्वाणो देववीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suṣvāṇo devavītaye ||
Translation: Like beauty for a brilliant show.

Sanskit Text: अर्षा सोम दयुमत्तमो.अभि दरोणानि रोरुवत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arṣā soma dyumattamo.abhi droṇāni roruvat |
Translation: 19 Soma, flow on exceeding bright with loud roar to the wooden vats,

Sanskit Text: सीदञ्छ्येनोन योनिमा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sīdañchyenona yonimā ||
Translation: Falcon-like resting in thine home.

Sanskit Text: अप्सा इन्द्राय वायवे वरुणाय मरुद्भ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apsā indrāya vāyave varuṇāya marudbhyaḥ |
Translation: 20 Soma, the Water-winner flows to Indra, Vāyu, Varuṇa,

Sanskit Text: सोमो अर्षति विष्णवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somo arṣati viṣṇave ||
Translation: To Viṣṇu and the Marut host.

Sanskit Text: इषं तोकाय नो दधदस्मभ्यं सोम विश्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣaṃ tokāya no dadhadasmabhyaṃ soma viśvataḥ |
Translation: 21 Soma , bestowing food upon our progeny, from every sides,

Sanskit Text: आ पवस्वसहस्रिणम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā pavasvasahasriṇam ||
Translation: Pour on us riches thousandfold

Sanskit Text: ये सोमासः परावति ये अर्वावति सुन्विरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye somāsaḥ parāvati ye arvāvati sunvire |
Translation: 22 The Soma juices which have been expressed afar or near at hand,

Sanskit Text: ये वादः शर्यणावति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye vādaḥ śaryaṇāvati ||
Translation: Or there on Śaryaṇāvān's bank,

Sanskit Text: य आर्जीकेषु कर्त्वसु ये मध्ये पस्त्यानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya ārjīkeṣu kṛtvasu ye madhye pastyānām |
Translation: 23 Those pressed among Arjikas, pressed among the active, in men's homes,

Sanskit Text: ये वा जनेषुपञ्चसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye vā janeṣupañcasu ||
Translation: Or pressed among the Races Five-

Sanskit Text: ते नो वर्ष्टिं दिवस परि पवन्तामा सुवीर्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te no vṛṣṭiṃ divas pari pavantāmā suvīryam |
Translation: 24 May these celestial drops, expressed, pour forth upon us, as they flow,

Sanskit Text: सुवाना देवास इन्दवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvānā devāsa indavaḥ ||
Translation: Rain from the heavens apd hero strength.

Sanskit Text: पवते हर्यतो हरिर्ग्र्णानो जमदग्निना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavate haryato harirghṛṇāno jamadaghninā |
Translation: 25 Urged forward o’er the ox-hide flows the Lovely One of tawny hue,

Sanskit Text: हिन्वानो गोरधित्वचि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hinvāno ghoradhitvaci ||
Translation: Lauded by Jamadagni's song.

Sanskit Text: पर शुक्रासो वयोजुवो हिन्वानासो न सप्तयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra śukrāso vayojuvo hinvānāso na saptayaḥ |
Translation: 26 Like horses urged to speed, the drops, bright, stirring vital power, when blent

Sanskit Text: शरीणानाप्सु मर्ञ्जत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrīṇānāapsu mṛñjata ||
Translation: With milk, are beautified in streams.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा सुतेष्वाभुवो हिन्विरे देवतातये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā suteṣvābhuvo hinvire devatātaye |
Translation: 27 So they who toil with juices send thee forward for the Gods’ repast:

Sanskit Text: स पवस्वानया रुचा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pavasvānayā rucā ||
Translation: So with this splendour flow thou on.

Sanskit Text: आ ते दक्षं मयोभुवं वह्निमद्या वर्णीमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā te dakṣaṃ mayobhuvaṃ vahnimadyā vṛṇīmahe |
Translation: 28 We choose to-day that chariot-steed of thine, the Strong, that brings us bliss,

Sanskit Text: पान्तमापुरुस्प्र्हम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāntamāpuruspṛham ||
Translation: The Guardian, the desire of all,

Sanskit Text: आ मन्द्रमा वरेण्यमा विप्रमा मनीषिणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā mandramā vareṇyamā vipramā manīṣiṇam |
Translation: 29 The Excellent, the Gladdener, the Sage with heart that understands,

Sanskit Text: पान्तमा पुरुस्प्र्हम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāntamā puruspṛham ||
Translation: The Guardian, the desire of all;

Sanskit Text: आ रयिमा सुचेतुनमा सुक्रतो तनूष्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā rayimā sucetunamā sukrato tanūṣvā |
Translation: 30 Who for ourselves, O thou Most Wise, is wealth and fair intelligence,

Sanskit Text: पान्तमा पुरुस्प्र्हम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāntamā puruspṛham ||
Translation: The Guardian, the desire of all.

Sanskit Text: तवं सोमासि धारयुर्मन्द्र ओजिष्ठो अध्वरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ somāsi dhārayurmandra ojiṣṭho adhvare |
Translation: 1. THOU, Soma, hast a running stream, joyous, most strong at sacrifice:

Sanskit Text: पवस्व मंहयद्रयिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva maṃhayadrayiḥ ||
Translation: Flow bounteously bestowing wealth.

Sanskit Text: तवं सुतो नर्मादनो दधन्वान मत्सरिन्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ suto nṛmādano dadhanvān matsarintamaḥ |
Translation: 2 Effused as cheerer of the men, flowing best gladdener, thou art

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय सूरिरन्धसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya sūrirandhasā ||
Translation: A Prince to Indra with thy juice.

Sanskit Text: तवं सुष्वाणो अद्रिभिरभ्यर्ष कनिक्रदत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ suṣvāṇo adribhirabhyarṣa kanikradat |
Translation: 3 Poured forth by pressing-stones, do thou with loud roar send us in a stream

Sanskit Text: दयुमन्तं शुष्ममुत्तमम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyumantaṃ śuṣmamuttamam ||
Translation: Most excellent illustrious might.

Sanskit Text: इन्दुर्हिन्वानो अर्षति तिरो वाराण्यव्यया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indurhinvāno arṣati tiro vārāṇyavyayā |
Translation: 4 Indu, urged forward, floweth through the fleecy cloth: the Tawny One

Sanskit Text: हरिर्वाजमचिक्रदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: harirvājamacikradat ||
Translation: With his loud roar hath brought as strength.

Sanskit Text: इन्दो वयव्यमर्षसि वि शरवांसि वि सौभगा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indo vyavyamarṣasi vi śravāṃsi vi saubhaghā |
Translation: 5 Indu, thou flowest through the fleece, bringing felicities and fame,

Sanskit Text: वि वाजांसोम गोमतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi vājāṃsoma ghomataḥ ||
Translation: And, Soma, spoil and wealth in kine.

Sanskit Text: आ न इन्दो शतग्विनं रयिं गोमन्तमश्विनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā na indo śataghvinaṃ rayiṃ ghomantamaśvinam |
Translation: 6 Hither, O Indu, bring us wealth in steeds and cattle hundredfold:

Sanskit Text: भरा सोम सहस्रिणम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharā soma sahasriṇam ||
Translation: Bring wealth, O Soma, thousandfold.

Sanskit Text: पवमानास इन्दवस्तिरः पवित्रमाशवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamānāsa indavastiraḥ pavitramāśavaḥ |
Translation: 7 In purifying, through the sieve the rapid drops of'Soma juice

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं यामेभिराशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ yāmebhirāśata ||
Translation: Come nigh to Indra in their course.

Sanskit Text: ककुहः सोम्यो रस इन्दुरिन्द्राय पूर्व्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kakuhaḥ somyo rasa indurindrāya pūrvyaḥ |
Translation: 8 For Indra floweth excellent Indu, the noblest Soma juice

Sanskit Text: आयुः पवत आयवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āyuḥ pavata āyave ||
Translation: The Living for the Living One.

Sanskit Text: हिन्वन्ति सूरमुस्रयः पवमानं मधुश्चुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hinvanti sūramusrayaḥ pavamānaṃ madhuścutam |
Translation: 9 The glittering maids send Sūra forth they with their song have sung aloud

Sanskit Text: अभि गिरा समस्वरन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi ghirā samasvaran ||
Translation: To Pavamana dropping meath.

Sanskit Text: अविता नो अजाश्वः पूषा यामनि-यामनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avitā no ajāśvaḥ pūṣā yāmani-yāmani |
Translation: 10 May Pūṣan, drawn by goats, be our protector, and on all his paths

Sanskit Text: आ भक्षत कन्यासु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā bhakṣat kanyāsu naḥ ||
Translation: Bestow on us our share of maids.

Sanskit Text: अयं सोमः कपर्दिने घर्तं न पवते मधु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ somaḥ kapardine ghṛtaṃ na pavate madhu |
Translation: 11 This Soma flows like gladdening oil for him who wears the braided locks:

Sanskit Text: आ भक्षत कन्यासु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā bhakṣat kanyāsu naḥ ||
Translation: He shall give us our share of maids.

Sanskit Text: अयं त आघ्र्णे सुतो घर्तं न पवते शुचि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ ta āghṛṇe suto ghṛtaṃ na pavate śuci |
Translation: 12 This Soma juice, O glowing God, flows like pure oil, effused for thee:

Sanskit Text: आ भक्षत कन्यासु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā bhakṣat kanyāsu naḥ ||
Translation: He shall give us our share of maids.

Sanskit Text: वाचो जन्तुः कवीनां पवस्व सोम धारया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāco jantuḥ kavīnāṃ pavasva soma dhārayā |
Translation: 13 Flow onward, Soma, in thy stream, begetter of the sages' speech:

Sanskit Text: देवेषु रत्नधा असि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: deveṣu ratnadhā asi ||
Translation: Wealth-giver among Gods art thou.

Sanskit Text: आ कलशेषु धावति शयेनो वर्म वि गाहते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā kalaśeṣu dhāvati śyeno varma vi ghāhate |
Translation: 14 The Falcon dips within the jars: he wrapḥim in his robe and goes

Sanskit Text: अभि दरोणा कनिक्रदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi droṇā kanikradat ||
Translation: Loud roaring to the vats of wood.

Sanskit Text: परि पर सोम ते रसो.असर्जि कलशे सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari pra soma te raso.asarji kalaśe sutaḥ |
Translation: 15 Soma, thy juice hath been effused and poured into the pitcher: like

Sanskit Text: शयेनो न तक्तोर्षति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śyeno na taktoarṣati ||
Translation: A rapid hawk it rushes on.

Sanskit Text: पवस्व सोम मन्दयन्निन्द्राय मधुमत्तमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva soma mandayannindrāya madhumattamaḥ ||
Translation: 16 For Indra flow most rich in sweets, O Soma, bringing him delight.

Sanskit Text: अस्र्ग्रन देववीतये वाजयन्तो रथा इव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asṛghran devavītaye vājayanto rathā iva ||
Translation: 17 They were sent forth to feast the Gods, like chariots that display their strength.

Sanskit Text: ते सुतासो मदिन्तमाः शुक्रा वायुमस्र्क्षत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te sutāso madintamāḥ śukrā vāyumasṛkṣata ||
Translation: 18 Brilliant, best givers of delight, these juices have sent Vāyu forth.

Sanskit Text: गराव्णा तुन्नो अभिष्टुतः पवित्रं सोम गछसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghrāvṇā tunno abhiṣṭutaḥ pavitraṃ soma ghachasi |
Translation: 19 Bruised by the press-stones and extolled, Soma, thou goest to the sieve,

Sanskit Text: दधत सतोत्रे सुवीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhat stotre suvīryam ||
Translation: Giving the worshipper hero strength.

Sanskit Text: एष तुन्नो अभिष्टुतः पवित्रमति गाहते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa tunno abhiṣṭutaḥ pavitramati ghāhate |
Translation: 20 This juice bruised by the pressing-stones and lauded passes through the sieve,

Sanskit Text: रक्षोहा वारमव्ययम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rakṣohā vāramavyayam ||
Translation: Slayer of demons, through the fleece.

Sanskit Text: यदन्ति यच्च दूरके भयं विन्दति मामिह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadanti yacca dūrake bhayaṃ vindati māmiha |
Translation: 21 O Pavamana, drive away the danger, whether near at hand

Sanskit Text: पवमानवि तज्जहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamānavi tajjahi ||
Translation: Or far remote, that finds me here.

Sanskit Text: पवमानः सो अद्य नः पवित्रेण विचर्षणिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamānaḥ so adya naḥ pavitreṇa vicarṣaṇiḥ |
Translation: 22 This day may Pavamana cleanse us with his purifying power,

Sanskit Text: यः पोतास पुनातु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ potāsa punātu naḥ ||
Translation: Most active purifying Priest.

Sanskit Text: यत ते पवित्रमर्चिष्यग्ने विततमन्तरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te pavitramarciṣyaghne vitatamantarā |
Translation: 23 O Agni, with the cleansing light diffused through all thy fiery glow,

Sanskit Text: बरह्म तेन पुनीहि नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahma tena punīhi naḥ ||
Translation: Purify thou this prayer of ours.

Sanskit Text: यत ते पवित्रमर्चिवदग्ने तेन पुनीहि नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te pavitramarcivadaghne tena punīhi naḥ |
Translation: 24 Cleanse us with thine own cleansing power, O Agni, that is bright with flame,

Sanskit Text: बरह्मसवैः पुनीहि नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmasavaiḥ punīhi naḥ ||
Translation: And by libations poured to thee.

Sanskit Text: उभाभ्यां देव सवितः पवित्रेण सवेन च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhābhyāṃ deva savitaḥ pavitreṇa savena ca |
Translation: 25 Savitar, God, by both of these, libation, purifying power,

Sanskit Text: मां पुनीहि विश्वतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: māṃ punīhi viśvataḥ ||
Translation: Purify me on every side.

Sanskit Text: तरिभिष टवं देव सवितर्वर्षिष्ठैः सोम धामभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tribhiṣ ṭvaṃ deva savitarvarṣiṣṭhaiḥ soma dhāmabhiḥ |
Translation: 26 Cleanse us, God Savitar, with Three, O Soma, with sublimest forms,

Sanskit Text: अग्ने दक्षैः पुनीहि नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne dakṣaiḥ punīhi naḥ ||
Translation: Agni, with forms of power and might.

Sanskit Text: पुनन्तु मां देवजनाः पुनन्तु वसवो धिया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: punantu māṃ devajanāḥ punantu vasavo dhiyā |
Translation: 27 May the Gods’ company make me clean, and Vasus make rue pure by song.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवाः पुनीत मा जातवेदः पुनीहि मा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devāḥ punīta mā jātavedaḥ punīhi mā ||
Translation: Purify me, ye General Gods; O Jātavedas, make me pure.

Sanskit Text: पर पयायस्व पर सयन्दस्व सोम विश्वेभिरंशुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra pyāyasva pra syandasva soma viśvebhiraṃśubhiḥ |
Translation: 28 Fill thyself full of juice, flow forth, O Soma, thou with all thy stalks,

Sanskit Text: देवेभ्य उत्तमं हविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devebhya uttamaṃ haviḥ ||
Translation: The best oblation to the Gods.

Sanskit Text: उप परियं पनिप्नतं युवानमाहुतीव्र्धम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa priyaṃ panipnataṃ yuvānamāhutīvṛdham |
Translation: 29 We with our homage have approached the Friend who seeks our wondering praise,

Sanskit Text: अगन्म बिभ्रतोनमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghanma bibhratonamaḥ ||
Translation: Young, strengthener of the solemn rite.

Sanskit Text: अलाय्यस्य परशुर्ननाश तमा पवस्व देव सोम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: alāyyasya paraśurnanāśa tamā pavasva deva soma |
Translation: 30 Lost is Alayya's axe. O Soma, God do thou send it back hither in thy flow

Sanskit Text: आखुं चिदेव देव सोम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ākhuṃ cideva deva soma ||
Translation: Even, Soma, God, if ’twere a mole.

Sanskit Text: यः पावमानीरध्येत्य रषिभिः सम्भ्र्तं रसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ pāvamānīradhyety ṛṣibhiḥ sambhṛtaṃ rasam |
Translation: 31 The man who reads the essence stored by saints, the Pavamani hymns,

Sanskit Text: सर्वंस पूतमश्नाति सवदितं मातरिश्वना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarvaṃsa pūtamaśnāti svaditaṃ mātariśvanā ||
Translation: Tastes food completely purified, made sweet by Mātariśvan's touch.

Sanskit Text: पावमानीर्यो अध्येत्य रषिभिः सम्भ्र्तं रसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāvamānīryo adhyety ṛṣibhiḥ sambhṛtaṃ rasam |
Translation: 32 Whoever reads the essence stored by saints, the Pavamani hymns,

Sanskit Text: तस्मै सरस्वती दुहे कषीरं सर्पिर्मधूदकम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmai sarasvatī duhe kṣīraṃ sarpirmadhūdakam ||
Translation: Sarasvatī draws forth for him water and butter, milk and meath.

Sanskit Text: पर देवमछा मधुमन्त इन्दवो.असिष्यदन्त गाव आ न धेनवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra devamachā madhumanta indavo.asiṣyadanta ghāva ā na dhenavaḥ |
Translation: 1. THE drops of Soma juice like cows who yield their milk have flowed forth, rich in meath, unto the Shining One,

Sanskit Text: बर्हिषदो वचनावन्त ऊधभिः परिस्रुतमुस्रियानिर्णिजं धिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: barhiṣado vacanāvanta ūdhabhiḥ parisrutamusriyānirṇijaṃ dhire ||
Translation: And, seated on the grass, raising their voice, assumed the milk, the covering robe wherewith the udders stream.

Sanskit Text: स रोरुवदभि पूर्वा अचिक्रददुपारुहः शरथयन सवादतेहरिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa roruvadabhi pūrvā acikradadupāruhaḥ śrathayan svādatehariḥ |
Translation: 2 He bellows with a roar arourd the highest twigs: the Tawny One is sweetened as he breaks them up.

Sanskit Text: तिरः पवित्रमप्रियन्नुरु जरयो नि शर्याणि दधते देव आ वरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tiraḥ pavitramapriyannuru jrayo ni śaryāṇi dadhate deva ā varam ||
Translation: Then passing through the sieve into the ample room, the God throws off the dregs according to his wish.

Sanskit Text: वि यो ममे यम्या संयती मदः साकंव्र्धा पयसा पिन्वदक्षिता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yo mame yamyā saṃyatī madaḥ sākaṃvṛdhā payasā pinvadakṣitā |
Translation: 3 The gladdening drink that measured out the meeting Twins fills full with milk the Eternal Ever-waxing Pair.

Sanskit Text: मही अपारे रजसी विवेविददभिव्रजन्नक्षितं पाज आ ददे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahī apāre rajasī vivevidadabhivrajannakṣitaṃ pāja ā dade ||
Translation: Bringing to light the Two great Regions limitless, moving above them he gained sheen that never fades.

Sanskit Text: स मातरा विचरन वाजयन्नपः पर मेधिरः सवधया पिन्वते पदम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa mātarā vicaran vājayannapaḥ pra medhiraḥ svadhayā pinvate padam |
Translation: 4 Wandering through, the Parents, strengthening the floods, the Sage makes his place swell with his own native might.

Sanskit Text: अंशुर्यवेन पिपिशे यतो नर्भिः सं जामिभिर्नसते रक्षते शिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṃśuryavena pipiśe yato nṛbhiḥ saṃ jāmibhirnasate rakṣate śiraḥ ||
Translation: The stalk is mixed with grain: he comes led by the men together with the sisters, and preserves the Head.

Sanskit Text: सं दक्षेण मनसा जायते कविरतस्य गर्भो निहितो यमा परः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ dakṣeṇa manasā jāyate kavirtasya gharbho nihito yamā paraḥ |
Translation: 5 With energetic intellect the Sage is born, deposited as germ of Law, far from the Twins.

Sanskit Text: यूना ह सन्ता परथमं वि जज्ञतुर्गुहा हितं जनिम नेममुद्यतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūnā ha santā prathamaṃ vi jajñaturghuhā hitaṃ janima nemamudyatam ||
Translation: They being young at first showed visibly distinct the Creature that is half-concealed and half-exposed.

Sanskit Text: मन्द्रस्य रूपं विविदुर्मनीषिणः शयेनो यदन्धो अभरत परावतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mandrasya rūpaṃ vividurmanīṣiṇaḥ śyeno yadandho abharat parāvataḥ |
Translation: 6 The sages knew the form of him the Gladdener, what time the Falcon brought the plant from far away.

Sanskit Text: तं मर्जयन्त सुव्र्धं नदीष्वा उशन्तमंशुं परियन्तं रग्मियम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ marjayanta suvṛdhaṃ nadīṣvā uśantamaṃśuṃ pariyantaṃ ṛghmiyam ||
Translation: Him who assures success they beautified in streams, the stalk who yearned therefor, mighty and meet for praise.

Sanskit Text: तवां मर्जन्ति दश योषणः सुतं सोम रषिभिर्मतिभिर्धीतिभिर्हितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ mṛjanti daśa yoṣaṇaḥ sutaṃ soma ṛṣibhirmatibhirdhītibhirhitam |
Translation: 7 Together with the Ṛṣis, with their prayers and hymns ten women deck thee, Soma, friendly when effused.

Sanskit Text: अव्यो वारेभिरुत देवहूतिभिर्न्र्भिर्यतोवाजमा दर्षि सातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avyo vārebhiruta devahūtibhirnṛbhiryatovājamā darṣi sātaye ||
Translation: Led by the men, with invocations of the Gods, through the fleece, thou hast given us strength to win the spoil.

Sanskit Text: परिप्रयन्तं वय्यं सुषंसदं सोमं मनीषा अभ्यनूषत सतुभः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pariprayantaṃ vayyaṃ suṣaṃsadaṃ somaṃ manīṣā abhyanūṣata stubhaḥ |
Translation: 8 Songs resonant with praise have celebrated him. Soma, Friend, springing forth with his fair company.

Sanskit Text: यो धारया मधुमानूर्मिणा दिव इयर्ति वाचं रयिषाळ अमर्त्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo dhārayā madhumānūrmiṇā diva iyarti vācaṃ rayiṣāḷ amartyaḥ ||
Translation: Even him who rich in meath, with undulating stream, Winnner of Wealth, Immortal, sends his voice from heaven,

Sanskit Text: अयं दिव इयर्ति विश्वमा रजः सोमः पुनानः कलशेषु सीदति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ diva iyarti viśvamā rajaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sīdati |
Translation: 9 He sends it into all the region forth from heaven. Soma, while he is filtcred, settles in the jars.

Sanskit Text: अद्भिर्गोभिर्म्र्ज्यते अद्रिभिः सुतः पुनान इन्दुर्वरिवो विदत परियम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adbhirghobhirmṛjyate adribhiḥ sutaḥ punāna indurvarivo vidat priyam ||
Translation: With milk and waters is he decked when pressed with stones: Indu, when purified, shall find sweet rest and room.

Sanskit Text: एवा नः सोम परिषिच्यमानो वयो दधच्चित्रतमं पवस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā naḥ soma pariṣicyamāno vayo dadhaccitratamaṃ pavasva |
Translation: 10 Even thus poured forth How on thy way, O Soma, vouchsafing us most manifold lively vigour.

Sanskit Text: अद्वेषे दयावाप्र्थिवी हुवेम देवा धत्त रयिमस्मे सुवीरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adveṣe dyāvāpṛthivī huvema devā dhatta rayimasme suvīram ||
Translation: We will invoke benevolent Earth and Heaven. Give us, ye Gods, riches with noble heroes.

Sanskit Text: इषुर्न धन्वन परति धीयते मतिर्वत्सो न मातुरुप सर्ज्यूधनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣurna dhanvan prati dhīyate matirvatso na māturupa sarjyūdhani |
Translation: 1. LAID like an arrow on the bow the hymn hath been loosed like a young calf to the udder of its dam.

Sanskit Text: उरुधारेव दुहे अग्र आयत्यस्य वरतेष्वपि सोम इष्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: urudhāreva duhe aghra āyatyasya vrateṣvapi soma iṣyate ||
Translation: As one who cometh first with full stream she is milked the Soma is impelled to this man's holy rites.

Sanskit Text: उपो मतिः पर्च्यते सिच्यते मधु मन्द्राजनी चोदते अन्तरासनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upo matiḥ pṛcyate sicyate madhu mandrājanī codate antarāsani |
Translation: 2 The thought is deeply fixed; the savoury juice is shed; the tongue with joyous sound is stirring in the mouth;

Sanskit Text: पवमानः सन्तनिः परघ्नतामिव मधुमान दरप्सः परि वारमर्षति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamānaḥ santaniḥ praghnatāmiva madhumān drapsaḥ pari vāramarṣati ||
Translation: And Pavamana, like the shout of combatants, the drop rising in sweet juice, is flowing through the fleece.

Sanskit Text: अव्ये वधूयुः पवते परि तवचि शरथ्नीते नप्तीरदितेरतं यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avye vadhūyuḥ pavate pari tvaci śrathnīte naptīraditertaṃ yate |
Translation: 3 He flows about the sheep-skin, longing for a bride: he looses Aditi's Daughters for the worshipper.

Sanskit Text: हरिरक्रान यजतः संयतो मदो नर्म्णा शिशानो महिषो न शोभते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: harirakrān yajataḥ saṃyato mado nṛmṇā śiśāno mahiṣo na śobhate ||
Translation: The sacred drink hath come, gold-tinted, well-restrained: like a strong Bull he shines, whetting his manly might.

Sanskit Text: उक्षा मिमाति परति यन्ति धेनवो देवस्य देवीरुप यन्ति निष्क्र्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukṣā mimāti prati yanti dhenavo devasya devīrupa yanti niṣkṛtam |
Translation: 4 The Bull is bellowing; the Cows are coming nigh: the Goddesses approach the God's own resting-place.

Sanskit Text: अत्यक्रमीदर्जुनं वारमव्ययमत्कं न निक्तम्परि सोमो अव्यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atyakramīdarjunaṃ vāramavyayamatkaṃ na niktampari somo avyata ||
Translation: Onward hath Soma passed through the sheep's fair bright fleece, and hath, as ’twere, endued a garment newly washed.

Sanskit Text: अम्र्क्तेन रुशता वाससा हरिरमर्त्यो निर्णिजानः परि वयत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: amṛktena ruśatā vāsasā hariramartyo nirṇijānaḥ pari vyata |
Translation: 5 The golden-hued, Immortal, newly bathed, puts on a brightly shining vesture that is never harmed.

Sanskit Text: दिवस पर्ष्ठं बर्हणा निर्णिजे कर्तोपस्तरणं चम्वोर्नभस्मयम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divas pṛṣṭhaṃ barhaṇā nirṇije kṛtopastaraṇaṃ camvornabhasmayam ||
Translation: He made the ridge of heaven to be his radiant robe, by sprinkling of the bowls from moisture of the sky.

Sanskit Text: सूर्यस्येव रश्मयो दरावयित्नवो मत्सरासः परसुपः साकमीरते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūryasyeva raśmayo drāvayitnavo matsarāsaḥ prasupaḥ sākamīrate |
Translation: 6 Even as the beams of Sūrya, urging men to speed, that cheer and send to sleep, together rush they forth,

Sanskit Text: तन्तुं ततं परि सर्गास आशवो नेन्द्राद रते पवते धाम किं चन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tantuṃ tataṃ pari sarghāsa āśavo nendrād ṛte pavate dhāma kiṃ cana ||
Translation: These swift outpourings in long course of holy rites: no form save only Indra shows itself so pure.

Sanskit Text: सिन्धोरिव परवणे निम्न आशवो वर्षच्युता मदासो गातुमाशत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sindhoriva pravaṇe nimna āśavo vṛṣacyutā madāso ghātumāśata |
Translation: 7 As down the steep slope of a river to the vale, drawn from the Steer the swift strong draughts have found a way.

Sanskit Text: शं नो निवेशे दविपदे चतुष्पदे.अस्मे वाजः सोम तिष्ठन्तु कर्ष्टयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no niveśe dvipade catuṣpade.asme vājaḥ soma tiṣṭhantu kṛṣṭayaḥ ||
Translation: Well be it with the men and cattle in our home. May powers, O Soma, may the people stay with us.

Sanskit Text: आ नः पवस्व वसुमद धिरण्यवदश्वावद गोमद यवमत सुवीर्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā naḥ pavasva vasumad dhiraṇyavadaśvāvad ghomad yavamat suvīryam |
Translation: 8 Pour out upon us wealth in goods, in gold, in steeds, in cattle and in corn, and great heroic strength.

Sanskit Text: यूयं हि सोम पितरो मम सथन दिवो मूर्धानःप्रस्थिता वयस्क्र्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyaṃ hi soma pitaro mama sthana divo mūrdhānaḥprasthitā vayaskṛtaḥ ||
Translation: Ye, Soma, are my Fathers, lifted up on high as heads of heaven and makers of the strength of life.

Sanskit Text: एते सोमाः पवमानास इन्द्रं रथा इव पर ययुः सातिमछ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete somāḥ pavamānāsa indraṃ rathā iva pra yayuḥ sātimacha |
Translation: 9 These Pavamanas here, these drops of Soma, to Indra have sped forth like cars to booty.

Sanskit Text: सुताः पवित्रमति यन्त्यव्यं हित्वी वव्रिं हरितोव्र्ष्तिमछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sutāḥ pavitramati yantyavyaṃ hitvī vavriṃ haritovṛṣtimacha ||
Translation: Effused, they pass the cleansing fleece, while, gold-hued, they cast their covering off to pour the rain down.

Sanskit Text: इन्दविन्द्राय बर्हते पवस्व सुम्र्ळीको अनवद्यो रिशादाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indavindrāya bṛhate pavasva sumṛḷīko anavadyo riśādāḥ |
Translation: 10 O Indu, flow thou on for lofty Indra, flow blameless, very gracious, foe-destroyer.

Sanskit Text: भरा चन्द्राणि गर्णते वसूनि देवैर्द्यावाप्र्थिवी परावतं नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharā candrāṇi ghṛṇate vasūni devairdyāvāpṛthivī prāvataṃ naḥ ||
Translation: Bring splendid treasures to the man who lauds thee. O Heaven and Earth, with all the Gods protect. us.

Sanskit Text: तरिरस्मै सप्त धेनवो दुदुह्रे सत्यामाशिरं पूर्व्ये वयोमनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trirasmai sapta dhenavo duduhre satyāmāśiraṃ pūrvye vyomani |
Translation: 1. THE three times seven Milch-kine in the eastern heaven have for this Soma poured the genuine milky draught.

Sanskit Text: चत्वार्यन्या भुवनानि निर्णिजे चारूणि चक्रे यद रतैरवर्धत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: catvāryanyā bhuvanāni nirṇije cārūṇi cakre yad ṛtairavardhata ||
Translation: Four other beauteous Creatures hath he made for his adornment, when he waxed in strength through holy rites.

Sanskit Text: स भिक्षमाणो अम्र्तस्य चारुण उभे दयावा काव्येना वि शश्रथे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa bhikṣamāṇo amṛtasya cāruṇa ubhe dyāvā kāvyenā vi śaśrathe |
Translation: 2 Longing for lovely Amṛta, by his wisdom he divided, each apart from other, earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: तेजिष्ठा अपो मंहना परि वयत यदी देवस्य शरवसा सदो विदुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tejiṣṭhā apo maṃhanā pari vyata yadī devasya śravasā sado viduḥ ||
Translation: He gladly wrapped himself in the most lucid floods, when through their glory they found the God's resting-place.

Sanskit Text: ते अस्य सन्तु केतवो.अम्र्त्यवो.अदाभ्यासो जनुषी उभे अनु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te asya santu ketavo.amṛtyavo.adābhyāso januṣī ubhe anu |
Translation: 3 May those his brilliant rays he ever free from death, inviolate, for both classes of created things,—

Sanskit Text: येभिर्न्र्म्णा च देव्या च पुनत आदिद राजानं मनना अग्र्भ्णत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yebhirnṛmṇā ca devyā ca punata ādid rājānaṃ mananā aghṛbhṇata ||
Translation: Rays wherewith powers of men and Gods are purified. Yea, even for this have sageswelcomed him as King.

Sanskit Text: स मर्ज्यमानो दशभिः सुकर्मभिः पर मध्यमासु मात्र्षुप्रमे सचा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa mṛjyamāno daśabhiḥ sukarmabhiḥ pra madhyamāsu mātṛṣuprame sacā |
Translation: 4 He, while he is adorned by the ten skilful ones, that he too in the Midmost Mothers may create,

Sanskit Text: वरतानि पानो अम्र्तस्व चारुण उभे नर्चक्षानु पश्यते विशौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vratāni pāno amṛtasva cāruṇa ubhe nṛcakṣāanu paśyate viśau ||
Translation: While he is watching o’er the lovely Amṛta's ways, looks on both races as Beholder of mankind.

Sanskit Text: स मर्म्र्जान इन्द्रियाय धायस ओभे अन्ता रोदसी हर्षते हितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa marmṛjāna indriyāya dhāyasa obhe antā rodasī harṣate hitaḥ |
Translation: 5 He, while he is adorned to stream forth mighty strength, rejoices in his place between the earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा शुष्मेण बाधते वि दुर्मतीरादेदिशानः शर्यहेव शुरुधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā śuṣmeṇa bādhate vi durmatīrādediśānaḥ śaryaheva śurudhaḥ ||
Translation: The Steer dispels the evil-hearted with his might, aiming at offerings as an archer at the game.

Sanskit Text: स मातरा न दद्र्शान उस्रियो नानददेति मरुतामिव सवनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa mātarā na dadṛśāna usriyo nānadadeti marutāmiva svanaḥ |
Translation: 6 Beholding, as it were, Two Mother Cows, the Steer goes roaring on his way even as the Maruts roar.

Sanskit Text: जानन्न्र्तं परथमं यत सवर्णरं परशस्तये कमव्र्णीत सुक्रतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jānannṛtaṃ prathamaṃ yat svarṇaraṃ praśastaye kamavṛṇīta sukratuḥ ||
Translation: Knowing Eternal Law, the earliest light of heaven, he, passing wise, was chosen out to tell it forth.

Sanskit Text: रुवति भीमो वर्षभस्तविष्यया शर्ङगे शिशानो हरिणीविचक्षणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ruvati bhīmo vṛṣabhastaviṣyayā śṛṅghe śiśāno hariṇīvicakṣaṇaḥ |
Translation: 7 The fearful Bull is bellowing with violent might, far-sighted, sharpening his yellowcoloured horns.

Sanskit Text: आ योनिं सोमः सुक्र्तं नि षीदति गव्ययीत्वग भवति निर्णिगव्ययी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yoniṃ somaḥ sukṛtaṃ ni ṣīdati ghavyayītvagh bhavati nirṇighavyayī ||
Translation: Soma assumes his seat in the well-fashioned place: the cowhide and the sheepskin are his ornament.

Sanskit Text: शुचिः पुनानस्तन्वमरेपसमव्ये हरिर्न्यधाविष्ट सानवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuciḥ punānastanvamarepasamavye harirnyadhāviṣṭa sānavi |
Translation: 8 Bright, making pure his body free from spot and stain, on the sheep's back the Golden-coloured hath flowed down.

Sanskit Text: जुष्टो मित्राय वरुणाय वायवे तरिधातु मधु करियते सुकर्मभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣṭo mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave tridhātu madhu kriyate sukarmabhiḥ ||
Translation: Acceptable to Mitra, Vāyu, Varuṇa, he is prepared as threefold meal by skilful men.

Sanskit Text: पवस्व सोम देववीतये वर्षेन्द्रस्य हार्दि सोमधानमा विश |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva soma devavītaye vṛṣendrasya hārdi somadhānamā viśa |
Translation: 9 Flow on for the God's banquet, Soma, as a Steer, and enter Indra's heart, the Soma's reservoir.

Sanskit Text: पुरा नो बाधाद दुरिताति पारय कषेत्रविद धि दिश आहा विप्र्छते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purā no bādhād duritāti pāraya kṣetravid dhi diśa āhā vipṛchate ||
Translation: Bear us beyond misfortune ere we be oppres. sed. the man who knows the land directs the man who asks.

Sanskit Text: हितो न सप्तिरभि वाजमर्षेन्द्रस्येन्दो जठरमा पवस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hito na saptirabhi vājamarṣendrasyendo jaṭharamā pavasva |
Translation: 10 Urged like a car-steed flow to strength, O Soma: Indu, flow onward to the throat of Indra.

Sanskit Text: नावा न सिन्धुमति पर्षि विद्वाञ्छूरो न युध्यन्नव नो निद सपः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāvā na sindhumati parṣi vidvāñchūro na yudhyannava no nida spaḥ ||
Translation: Skilled, bear us past, as in a boat o’er water: as battling Hero save us from the foeman.

Sanskit Text: आ दक्षिणा सर्ज्यते शुष्म्यासदं वेति दरुहो रक्षसः पाति जाग्र्विः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā dakṣiṇā sṛjyate śuṣmyāsadaṃ veti druho rakṣasaḥ pāti jāghṛviḥ |
Translation: 1. THE guerdon is bestowed: the Mighty takes his Seat, and, ever-Watchful, guards from fiend and evil sprite.

Sanskit Text: हरिरोपशं कर्णुते नभस पय उपस्तिरे चम्वोर्ब्रह्म निर्णिजे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hariropaśaṃ kṛṇute nabhas paya upastire camvorbrahma nirṇije ||
Translation: Gold-hued, he makes the cloud his diadem, the milk his carpet in both worlds, and prayer his robe of state.

Sanskit Text: पर करिष्टिहेव शूष एति रोरुवदसुर्यं वर्णं नि रिणीते अस्य तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra kriṣṭiheva śūṣa eti roruvadasuryaṃ varṇaṃ ni riṇīte asya tam |
Translation: 2 Strong, bellowing, he goes, like one who slays the folk; he lets this hue of Asuras flow off from him,

Sanskit Text: जहाति वव्रिं पितुरेति निष्क्र्तमुपप्रुतं कर्णुते निर्णिजं तना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jahāti vavriṃ pitureti niṣkṛtamupaprutaṃ kṛṇute nirṇijaṃ tanā ||
Translation: Throws off his covering, seeks his father's meeting-place, and thus makes for himself the bright robe he assumes.

Sanskit Text: अद्रिभिः सुतः पवते गभस्त्योर्व्र्षायते नभसा वेपते मती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adribhiḥ sutaḥ pavate ghabhastyorvṛṣāyate nabhasā vepate matī |
Translation: 3 Onward he flows, from both the hands, pressed out with stones: excited by the prayer, the water makes him wild.

Sanskit Text: स मोदते नसते साधते गिरा नेनिक्ते अप्सु यजते परीमणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa modate nasate sādhate ghirā nenikte apsu yajate parīmaṇi ||
Translation: He frolics and draws near, completes his work with song, and bathes in streams to satisfy the worshipper.

Sanskit Text: परि दयुक्षं सहसः पर्वताव्र्धं मध्वः सिञ्चन्ति हर्म्यस्य सक्षणिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari dyukṣaṃ sahasaḥ parvatāvṛdhaṃ madhvaḥ siñcanti harmyasya sakṣaṇim |
Translation: 4 They pour out meath around the Master of the house, Celestial Strengthener of the mountain that gives might;

Sanskit Text: आ यस्मिन गावः सुहुताद ऊधनि मूर्धंछ्रीणन्त्यग्रियं वरीमभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yasmin ghāvaḥ suhutāda ūdhani mūrdhaṃchrīṇantyaghriyaṃ varīmabhiḥ ||
Translation: In whom, through his great powers, oblation-eating cows in their uplifted udder mix their choicest milk.

Sanskit Text: समी रथं न भुरिजोरहेषत दश सवसारो अदितेरुपस्थ आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samī rathaṃ na bhurijoraheṣata daśa svasāro aditerupastha ā |
Translation: 5 They, the ten sisters, on the lap of Aditi, have sent him forward like a car from both the arms.

Sanskit Text: जिगादुप जरयति गोरपीच्यं पदं यदस्य मतुथा अजीजनन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jighādupa jrayati ghorapīcyaṃ padaṃ yadasya matuthā ajījanan ||
Translation: He wanders and comes near the Cow's mysterious place, even the place which his inventions have produced.

Sanskit Text: शयेनो न योनिं सदनं धिया कर्तं हिरण्ययमासदं देव एषति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śyeno na yoniṃ sadanaṃ dhiyā kṛtaṃ hiraṇyayamāsadaṃ deva eṣati |
Translation: 6 Like as a falcon to his home, so speeds the God to his own golden wisely-tashioned place to rest.

Sanskit Text: ए रिणन्ति बर्हिषि परियं गिराश्वो न देवानप्येति यज्ञियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: e riṇanti barhiṣi priyaṃ ghirāśvo na devānapyeti yajñiyaḥ ||
Translation: With song they urge the darling to the sacred grass: the Holy One goes like a courser to the Gods.

Sanskit Text: परा वयक्तो अरुषो दिवः कविर्व्र्षा तरिप्र्ष्ठो अनविष्टगा अभि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parā vyakto aruṣo divaḥ kavirvṛṣā tripṛṣṭho anaviṣṭaghā abhi |
Translation: 7 From far away, from heaven, the redhued noted Sage, Steer of the triple height, hath sung unto the kine.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रणीतिर्यतिः परायती रेभो न पूर्वीरुषसो वि राजति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasraṇītiryatiḥ parāyatī rebho na pūrvīruṣaso vi rājati ||
Translation: With thousand guidings he, leading this way and that, shines, as a singer, splendidly through many a morn.

Sanskit Text: तवेषं रूपं कर्णुते वर्णो अस्य स यत्राशयत सम्र्ता सेधति सरिधः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tveṣaṃ rūpaṃ kṛṇute varṇo asya sa yatrāśayat samṛtā sedhati sridhaḥ |
Translation: 8 His covering assumes a radiant hue; where’er he comes into the fight he drives the foe afar.

Sanskit Text: अप्सा याति सवधया दैव्यं जनं सं सुष्टुती नसते सं गोग्रया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apsā yāti svadhayā daivyaṃ janaṃ saṃ suṣṭutī nasate saṃ ghoaghrayā ||
Translation: The Winner of the Floods, with food he seeks the host of heaven, he comes to praises glorified with milk.

Sanskit Text: उक्षेव यूथा परियन्नरावीदधि तविषीरधित सूर्यस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukṣeva yūthā pariyannarāvīdadhi tviṣīradhita sūryasya |
Translation: 9 Like a bull roaming round the herds he bellows: he hath assumed the brilliancy of Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: दिव्यः सुपर्णो.अव चक्षत कषां सोमः परि करतुना पश्यते जाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divyaḥ suparṇo.ava cakṣata kṣāṃ somaḥ pari kratunā paśyate jāḥ ||
Translation: Down to the earth hath looked the heavenly Falcon: Soma with wisdom views all living creatures.

Sanskit Text: हरिं मर्जन्त्यरुषो न युज्यते सं धेनुभिः कलशे सोमो अज्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hariṃ mṛjantyaruṣo na yujyate saṃ dhenubhiḥ kalaśe somo ajyate |
Translation: 1. THEY cleanse the Gold-hued: like a red Steed is he yoked, and Soma in the jar is mingled with the milk.

Sanskit Text: उद वाचमीरयति हिन्वते मती पुरुष्टुतस्य कति चित्परिप्रियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud vācamīrayati hinvate matī puruṣṭutasya kati citparipriyaḥ ||
Translation: He sendeth out his voice, and many loving friends of him the highly lauded hasten with their songs.

Sanskit Text: साकं वदन्ति बहवो मनीषिण इन्द्रस्य सोमं जठरे यदादुहुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sākaṃ vadanti bahavo manīṣiṇa indrasya somaṃ jaṭhare yadāduhuḥ |
Translation: 2 The many sages utter words in unison, while into Indra's throat they pour the Soma juice,

Sanskit Text: यदी मर्जन्ति सुगभस्तयो नरः सनीळाभिर्दशभिः काम्यं मधु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadī mṛjanti sughabhastayo naraḥ sanīḷābhirdaśabhiḥ kāmyaṃ madhu ||
Translation: When, with the ten that dwell together closely joined, the men whose hands are skilful cleanse the lovely meath.

Sanskit Text: अरममाणो अत्येति गा अभि सूर्यस्य परियं दुहितुस्तिरो रवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aramamāṇo atyeti ghā abhi sūryasya priyaṃ duhitustiro ravam |
Translation: 3 He goes upon his way, unresting, to the cows, over the roaring sound which Sarya's Daughter loves.

Sanskit Text: अन्वस्मै जोषमभरद विनंग्र्सः सं दवयीभिः सवस्र्भिः कषेति जामिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anvasmai joṣamabharad vinaṃghṛsaḥ saṃ dvayībhiḥ svasṛbhiḥ kṣeti jāmibhiḥ ||
Translation: The Falcon brought it to him for his own delight: now with the twofold kindred sisters is his home.

Sanskit Text: नर्धूतो अद्रिषुतो बर्हिषि परियः पतिर्गवां परदिव इन्दुरतवियः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛdhūto adriṣuto barhiṣi priyaḥ patirghavāṃ pradiva indurtviyaḥ |
Translation: 4 Washed by the men, stone-pressed, dear on the holy grass, faithful to seasons, Lord of cattle from of old,

Sanskit Text: पुरन्धिवान मनुषो यज्ञसाधनः शुचिर्धियापवते सोम इन्द्र ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purandhivān manuṣo yajñasādhanaḥ śucirdhiyāpavate soma indra te ||
Translation: Most liberal, completing sacrifice for men, O Indra, pure bright Soma, Indu, flows for thee.

Sanskit Text: नर्बाहुभ्यां चोदितो धारया सुतो.अनुष्वधं पवते सोम इन्द्र ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛbāhubhyāṃ codito dhārayā suto.anuṣvadhaṃ pavate soma indra te |
Translation: 5 O Indra, urged by arms of men and poured in streams, Soma flows on for thee afterḥis Godlike kind.

Sanskit Text: आप्राः करतून समजैरध्वरे मतीर्वेर्न दरुषच्चम्वोरासदद धरिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āprāḥ kratūn samajairadhvare matīrverna druṣaccamvorāsadad dhariḥ ||
Translation: Plans thou fulfillest, gatherest thoughts for sacrifice: in the bowls sits the Gold-hued like a roosting bird.

Sanskit Text: अंशुं दुहन्ति सतनयन्तमक्षितं कविं कवयो.अपसो मनीषिणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṃśuṃ duhanti stanayantamakṣitaṃ kaviṃ kavayo.apaso manīṣiṇaḥ |
Translation: 6 Sages well-skilled in work, intelligent, drain out the stalk that roars, the Sage, the Everlasting One.

Sanskit Text: समी गावो मतयो यन्ति संयत रतस्य योना सदने पुनर्भुवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samī ghāvo matayo yanti saṃyata ṛtasya yonā sadane punarbhuvaḥ ||
Translation: The milk, the hymns unite them with him in the place of sacrifice, his seat who is produced anew.

Sanskit Text: नाभा पर्थिव्या धरुणो महो दिवो.अपामूर्मौ सिन्धुष्वन्तरुक्षितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nābhā pṛthivyā dharuṇo maho divo.apāmūrmau sindhuṣvantarukṣitaḥ |
Translation: 7 Earth's central point, sustainer of the mighty heavens, distilled into the streams, into the waters' wave,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य वज्रो वर्षभो विभूवसुः सोमो हर्देपवते चारु मत्सरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya vajro vṛṣabho vibhūvasuḥ somo hṛdepavate cāru matsaraḥ ||
Translation: As Indra's thunderbolt, Steer with farspreading wealth, Soma is flowing on to make the heart rejoice.

Sanskit Text: स तू पवस्व परि पार्थिवं रज सतोत्रे शिक्षन्नाधून्वते च सुक्रतो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tū pavasva pari pārthivaṃ raja stotre śikṣannādhūnvate ca sukrato |
Translation: 8 Over the earthly region flow thou on thy way, helping the praiser and the pourer, thou Most Wise.

Sanskit Text: मा नो निर्भाग वसुनः सादनस्प्र्शो रयिं पिशङगं बहुलं वसीमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no nirbhāgh vasunaḥ sādanaspṛśo rayiṃ piśaṅghaṃ bahulaṃ vasīmahi ||
Translation: Let us not lack rich treasure reaching to our home, and may we clothe ourselves in manifold bright wealth.

Sanskit Text: आ तू न इन्दो शतदात्वश्व्यं सहस्रदातु पशुमद धिरण्यवत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tū na indo śatadātvaśvyaṃ sahasradātu paśumad dhiraṇyavat |
Translation: 9 Hither, O Indu, unto us a hundred gifts of steeds, a thousand gifts of cattle and of gold,

Sanskit Text: उप मास्व बर्हती रेवतीरिषो.अधि सतोत्रस्य पवमान नो गहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa māsva bṛhatī revatīriṣo.adhi stotrasya pavamāna no ghahi ||
Translation: Measure thou forth, yea, splendid ample strengthening food do thou, O Pavamana, heed this laud of ours.

Sanskit Text: सरक्वे दरप्सस्य धमतः समस्वरन्न्र्तस्य योना समरन्तनाभयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: srakve drapsasya dhamataḥ samasvarannṛtasya yonā samarantanābhayaḥ |
Translation: 1. THEY from the spouting drop have sounded at the rim: naves speed together to the place of sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: तरीन स मूर्ध्नो असुरश्चक्र आरभे सत्यस्यनावः सुक्र्तमपीपरन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trīn sa mūrdhno asuraścakra ārabhe satyasyanāvaḥ sukṛtamapīparan ||
Translation: That Asura hath formed, to seize, three lofty heights. The ships of truth have borne the pious man across.

Sanskit Text: सम्यक सम्यञ्चो महिषा अहेषत सिन्धोरूर्मावधि वेना अवीविपन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samyak samyañco mahiṣā aheṣata sindhorūrmāvadhi venā avīvipan |
Translation: 2 The strong Steers, gathering, have duly stirred themselves,and over the stream's wave the friends sent forth the song.

Sanskit Text: मधोर्धाराभिर्जनयन्तो अर्कमित परियामिन्द्रस्य तन्वमवीव्र्धन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhordhārābhirjanayanto arkamit priyāmindrasya tanvamavīvṛdhan ||
Translation: Engendering the hymn, with flowing streams of meath, Indra's dear body have they caused to wax in strength.

Sanskit Text: पवित्रवन्तः परि वाचमासते पितैषां परत्नो अभि रक्षति वरतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavitravantaḥ pari vācamāsate pitaiṣāṃ pratno abhi rakṣati vratam |
Translation: 3 With sanctifying gear they sit around the song: their ancient Father guards their holy work from harm.

Sanskit Text: महः समुद्रं वरुणस्तिरो दधे धीरा इच्छेकुर्धरुणेष्वारभम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahaḥ samudraṃ varuṇastiro dadhe dhīrā icchekurdharuṇeṣvārabham ||
Translation: Varuṇa hath o’erspread the mighty sea of air. Sages had power to hold him in sustaining floods.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रधारे.अव ते समस्वरन दिवो नाके मधुजिह्वा असश्चतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasradhāre.ava te samasvaran divo nāke madhujihvā asaścataḥ |
Translation: 4 Sweet-tongued, exhaustless, they have sent their voices down togetlier, in heaven's vault that pours a thousand streams.

Sanskit Text: अस्य सपशो न नि मिषन्ति भूर्णयः पदे-पदे पाशिनः सन्ति सेतवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya spaśo na ni miṣanti bhūrṇayaḥ pade-pade pāśinaḥ santi setavaḥ ||
Translation: His wildly-restless warders never close an eye: in every place are found the bonds that bind man last.

Sanskit Text: पितुर्मातुरध्या ये समस्वरन्न्र्चा शोचन्तः सन्दहन्तो अव्रतान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: piturmāturadhyā ye samasvarannṛcā śocantaḥ sandahanto avratān |
Translation: 5 O'er Sire and Mother they have roared in unison bright with the verse of praise, burning up riteless men,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रद्विष्टामप धमन्ति मायया तवचमसिक्नीं भूमनो दिवस परि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indradviṣṭāmapa dhamanti māyayā tvacamasiknīṃ bhūmano divas pari ||
Translation: Blowing away with supernatural might from earth and from the heavens the swarthy skin which Indra hates.

Sanskit Text: परत्नान मानादध्या ये समस्वरञ्छ्लोकयन्त्रासो रभसस्य मन्तवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratnān mānādadhyā ye samasvarañchlokayantrāso rabhasasya mantavaḥ |
Translation: 6 Those which, as guides of song and counsellors of speed, were manifested from their ancient dwelling place,—

Sanskit Text: अपानक्षासो बधिरा अहासत रतस्य पन्थां न तरन्ति दुष्क्र्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apānakṣāso badhirā ahāsata ṛtasya panthāṃ na taranti duṣkṛtaḥ ||
Translation: From these the eyeless and the deaf have turned aside: the wicked travel not the pathway of the Law.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रधारे वितते पवित्र आ वाचं पुनन्ति कवयो मनीषिणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasradhāre vitate pavitra ā vācaṃ punanti kavayo manīṣiṇaḥ |
Translation: 7 What time the filter with a thousand streams is stretched, the thoughtful sages purify their song therein.

Sanskit Text: रुद्रास एषामिषिरासो अद्रुह सपशः सवञ्चः सुद्र्शो नर्चक्षसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rudrāsa eṣāmiṣirāso adruha spaśaḥ svañcaḥ sudṛśo nṛcakṣasaḥ ||
Translation: Bright-coloured are their spies, vigorous, void of guile, excellent, fair to see, beholders of mankind.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य गोपा न दभाय सुक्रतुस्त्री ष पवित्रा हर्द्यन्तरा दधे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya ghopā na dabhāya sukratustrī ṣa pavitrā hṛdyantarā dadhe |
Translation: 8 Guardian of Law, most wise, he may not be deceived: three Purifiers hath he set within his heart.

Sanskit Text: विद्वान स विश्वा भुवनाभि पश्यत्यवाजुष्टान विध्यति कर्ते अव्रतान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidvān sa viśvā bhuvanābhi paśyatyavājuṣṭān vidhyati karte avratān ||
Translation: With wisdom he beholds all creatures that exist: he drives into the pit the hated riteliess ones.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य तन्तुर्विततः पवित्र आ जिह्वाया अग्रे वरुणस्य मायया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya tanturvitataḥ pavitra ā jihvāyā aghre varuṇasya māyayā |
Translation: 9 The thread of sacrifice spun in the cleansing sieve, on Varuṇa's tongue-tip, by supernatural might,—

Sanskit Text: धीराश्चित तत समिनक्षन्त आशतात्रा कर्तमव पदात्यप्रभुह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhīrāścit tat saminakṣanta āśatātrā kartamava padātyaprabhuh ||
Translation: This, by their striving, have the prudent ones attained: he who hath not this power shall sink into the pit.

Sanskit Text: शिशुर्न जातो.अव चक्रदद वने सवर्यद वाज्यरुषः सिषासति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śiśurna jāto.ava cakradad vane svaryad vājyaruṣaḥ siṣāsati |
Translation: 1. BORN like a youngling he hath clamoured in the wood, when he, the Red, the Strong, would win the light of heaven.

Sanskit Text: दिवो रेतसा सचते पयोव्र्धा तमीमहे सुमती शर्म सप्रथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo retasā sacate payovṛdhā tamīmahe sumatī śarma saprathaḥ ||
Translation: He comes with heavenly seed that makes the water swell: him for wide-spreading shelter we implore with prayer.

Sanskit Text: दिवो य सकम्भो धरुणः सवातत आपूर्णो अंशुः पर्येतिविश्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo ya skambho dharuṇaḥ svātata āpūrṇo aṃśuḥ paryetiviśvataḥ |
Translation: 2 A far-extended pillar that supports the sky the Soma-stalk, filled full, moves itself every way.
