Sanskit Text: सेमे मही रोदसी यक्षदाव्र्ता समीचीने दाधार समिषः कविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: seme mahī rodasī yakṣadāvṛtā samīcīne dādhāra samiṣaḥ kaviḥ ||
Translation: He shall bring both these great worlds while the rite proceeds: the Sage holds these who move! together and all food.

Sanskit Text: महि पसरः सुक्र्तं सोम्यं मधूर्वी गव्यूतिरदितेरतं यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahi psaraḥ sukṛtaṃ somyaṃ madhūrvī ghavyūtiraditertaṃ yate |
Translation: 3 Wide space hath he who follows Aditi's right path, and mighty, well-made food, meath blent with Soma juice;

Sanskit Text: ईशे यो वर्ष्टेरित उस्रियो वर्षापां नेता य इतूतिरगमियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: īśe yo vṛṣṭerita usriyo vṛṣāpāṃ netā ya itaūtirghmiyaḥ ||
Translation: He who from hence commands the rain, Steer of the kine, Leader of floods, who helps us hence, who claims our laud.

Sanskit Text: आत्मन्वन नभो दुह्यते घर्तं पय रतस्य नाभिरम्र्तं विजायते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ātmanvan nabho duhyate ghṛtaṃ paya ṛtasya nābhiramṛtaṃ vijāyate |
Translation: 4 Butter and milk are drawn from animated cloud; thence Amṛta is produced, centre of sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: समीचीनाः सुदानवः परीणन्ति तं नरो हितमव मेहन्ति पेरवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samīcīnāḥ sudānavaḥ prīṇanti taṃ naro hitamava mehanti peravaḥ ||
Translation: Hini the Most Bounteous Ones, ever united, love; him as ouir Friend the Men who make all swell rain down.

Sanskit Text: अरावीदंशुः सचमान ऊर्मिणा देवाव्यं मनुषे पिन्वतित्वचम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arāvīdaṃśuḥ sacamāna ūrmiṇā devāvyaṃ manuṣe pinvatitvacam |
Translation: 5 The Soma-stalk hath roared, following with the wave: he swells with sap for man the skin which Gods enjoy.

Sanskit Text: दधाति गर्भमदितेरुपस्थ आ येन तोकं च तनयं च धामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhāti gharbhamaditerupastha ā yena tokaṃ ca tanayaṃ ca dhāmahe ||
Translation: Upon the lap of Aditi he lays the germ, by means whereof we gain children and progeny.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रधारे.अव ता असश्चतस्त्र्तीये सन्तु रजसि परजावतीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasradhāre.ava tā asaścatastṛtīye santu rajasi prajāvatīḥ |
Translation: 6 In the third region which distils a thousand streams, may the Exhaustless Ones descend with procreant power.

Sanskit Text: चतस्रो नाभो निहिता अवो दिवो हविर्भरन्त्यम्र्तं घर्तश्चुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: catasro nābho nihitā avo divo havirbharantyamṛtaṃ ghṛtaścutaḥ ||
Translation: The kindred Four have been sent downward from the heavens: dropping with oil they bring Amṛta and sacred gifts.

Sanskit Text: शवेतं रूपं कर्णुते यत सिषासति सोमो मीढ्वानसुरो वेद भूमनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śvetaṃ rūpaṃ kṛṇute yat siṣāsati somo mīḍhvānasuro veda bhūmanaḥ |
Translation: 7 Soma assumes white colour when he strives to gain: the bounteous Asura knows full many a precious boon.

Sanskit Text: धिया शमी सचते सेमभि परवद दिवस कवन्धमव दर्षदुद्रिणम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiyā śamī sacate semabhi pravad divas kavandhamava darṣadudriṇam ||
Translation: Down the steep slope, through song, he comes to sacrifice, and he will burst the water-holding cask of heaven,

Sanskit Text: अध शवेतं कलशं गोभिरक्तं कार्ष्मन्ना वाज्यक्रमीत ससवान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha śvetaṃ kalaśaṃ ghobhiraktaṃ kārṣmannā vājyakramīt sasavān |
Translation: 8 Yea, to the shining milk-anointed beaker, as to his goal, hath stepped the conquering Courser.

Sanskit Text: आ हिन्विरे मनसा देवयन्तः कक्षीवते शतहिमाय गोनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā hinvire manasā devayantaḥ kakṣīvate śatahimāya ghonām ||
Translation: Pious-souled men have sent their giffi of cattle unto Kakṣīvān of the hundred winters.

Sanskit Text: अद्भिः सोम पप्र्चानस्य ते रसो.अव्यो वारं वि पवमान धावति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adbhiḥ soma papṛcānasya te raso.avyo vāraṃ vi pavamāna dhāvati |
Translation: 9 Soma, thy juice when thou art blended with the streams, flows, Pavamana, through the long wool of the sheep.

Sanskit Text: स मर्ज्यमानः कविभिर्मदिन्तम सवदस्वेन्द्राय पवमान पीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa mṛjyamānaḥ kavibhirmadintama svadasvendrāya pavamāna pītaye ||
Translation: So, cleansed by sages. O best giver of delight, grow sweet for Indra, Pavamana! for his drink.

Sanskit Text: अभि परियाणि पवते चनोहितो नामानि यह्वो अधि येषु वर्धते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi priyāṇi pavate canohito nāmāni yahvo adhi yeṣu vardhate |
Translation: 1. GRACIOUSLY-MINDED he is flowing on his way to win dear names o’er which the Youthful One grows great.

Sanskit Text: आ सूर्यस्य बर्हतो बर्हन्नधि रथं विष्वञ्चमरुहद विचक्षणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā sūryasya bṛhato bṛhannadhi rathaṃ viṣvañcamaruhad vicakṣaṇaḥ ||
Translation: The Mighty and Far-seeing One hath mounted now the mighty Sūrya's car which moves to every side.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य जिह्वा पवते मधु परियं वक्ता पतिर्धियो अस्या अदाभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya jihvā pavate madhu priyaṃ vaktā patirdhiyo asyā adābhyaḥ |
Translation: 2 The Speaker, unassailable Master of this hymn, the Tongue of sacrifice pours forth the pleasant meath.

Sanskit Text: दधाति पुत्रः पित्रोरपीच्यं नाम तर्तीयमधि रोचने दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhāti putraḥ pitrorapīcyaṃ nāma tṛtīyamadhi rocane divaḥ ||
Translation: Within the lustrous region of the heavens the Son makes the third secret name of Mother and of Sire.

Sanskit Text: अव दयुतानः कलशानचिक्रदन नर्भिर्येमानः कोश आ हिरण्यये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava dyutānaḥ kalaśānacikradan nṛbhiryemānaḥ kośa ā hiraṇyaye |
Translation: 3 Sending forth flashes he hath bellowed to the jars, led by the men into the golden reservoir.

Sanskit Text: अभीं रतस्य दोहना अनूषताधि तरिप्र्ष्ठ उषसो वि राजति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhīṃ ṛtasya dohanā anūṣatādhi tripṛṣṭha uṣaso vi rājati ||
Translation: The milky streams of sacrifice have sung to him: he of the triple height shines brightly through the morns.

Sanskit Text: अद्रिभिः सुतो मतिभिश्चनोहितः पररोचयन रोदसी मातराशुचिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adribhiḥ suto matibhiścanohitaḥ prarocayan rodasī mātarāśuciḥ |
Translation: 4 Pressed by the stones, with hymns, and graciously inclined, illuminating both the Parents, Heaven and Earth,

Sanskit Text: रोमाण्यव्या समया वि धावति मधोर्धारा पिन्वमाना दिवे-दिवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: romāṇyavyā samayā vi dhāvati madhordhārā pinvamānā dive-dive ||
Translation: He flows in ordered season onward through the flee, a current of sweet juice still swelling day by day.

Sanskit Text: परि सोम पर धन्वा सवस्तये नर्भिः पुनानो अभि वासयाशिरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari soma pra dhanvā svastaye nṛbhiḥ punāno abhi vāsayāśiram |
Translation: 5 Flow onward, Soma, flow to bring prosperity: cleansed by the men, invest thee with the milky draught.

Sanskit Text: ये ते मदा आहनसो विहायसस्तेभिरिन्द्रं चोदय दातवे मघम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye te madā āhanaso vihāyasastebhirindraṃ codaya dātave magham ||
Translation: What gladdening drinks thou hast, foaming, exceeding strong, even with these incite Indra to give us wealth.

Sanskit Text: धर्ता दिवः पवते कर्त्व्यो रसो दक्षो देवानामनुमाद्यो नर्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhartā divaḥ pavate kṛtvyo raso dakṣo devānāmanumādyo nṛbhiḥ |
Translation: 1. ON flows the potent juice, sustainer of the heavens, the strength of Gods, whom men must hail with shouts of joy.

Sanskit Text: हरिः सर्जानो अत्यो न सत्वभिर्व्र्था पाजांसि कर्णुते नदीष्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hariḥ sṛjāno atyo na satvabhirvṛthā pājāṃsi kṛṇute nadīṣvā ||
Translation: The Gold-hued, started like a courser by brave men, impetuously winneth splendour in the streams.

Sanskit Text: शूरो न धत्त आयुधा गभस्त्योः सवः सिषासन रथिरो गविष्टिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śūro na dhatta āyudhā ghabhastyoḥ svaḥ siṣāsan rathiro ghaviṣṭiṣu |
Translation: 2 He takes his weapons, like a hero, in his hands, fain to win light, car-borne, in forays for the kine.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य शुष्ममीरयन्नपस्युभिरिन्दुर्हिन्वानो अज्यते मनीषिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya śuṣmamīrayannapasyubhirindurhinvāno ajyate manīṣibhiḥ ||
Translation: Indu, while stimulating India's might, is urged forward and balmed by sages skilful in their task.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य सोम पवमान ऊर्मिणा तविष्यमाणो जठरेष्वाविश |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya soma pavamāna ūrmiṇā taviṣyamāṇo jaṭhareṣvāviśa |
Translation: 3 Soma, as thou art purified with flowing wave, exhibiting thy strength enter thou Indra's throat.

Sanskit Text: पर णः पिन्व विद्युदभ्रेव रोदसी धिया न वाजानुप मासि शश्वतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ṇaḥ pinva vidyudabhreva rodasī dhiyā na vājānupa māsi śaśvataḥ ||
Translation: Make both worlds stream for us, as lightning doth the clouds: mete out exhaustless powers for us, as ’twere through song.

Sanskit Text: विश्वस्य राजा पवते सवर्द्र्श रतस्य धीतिं रषिषाळ अवीवशत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvasya rājā pavate svardṛśa ṛtasya dhītiṃ ṛṣiṣāḷ avīvaśat |
Translation: 4 Onward he flows, the King of all that sees the light: the Ṛṣis’ Lord hath raised the song of sacrifice;

Sanskit Text: यः सूर्यस्यासिरेण मर्ज्यते पिता मतीनामसमष्टकाव्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ sūryasyāsireṇa mṛjyate pitā matīnāmasamaṣṭakāvyaḥ ||
Translation: Even he who is adorned with Sūrya's arrowy beam, Father of hymns, whose wisdom is beyond our reach.

Sanskit Text: वर्षेव यूथा परि कोशमर्षस्यपामुपस्थे वर्षभः कनिक्रदत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣeva yūthā pari kośamarṣasyapāmupasthe vṛṣabhaḥ kanikradat |
Translation: 5 Like as a bull to herds, thou flowest to the pail, bellowing as a steer upon the water's lap.

Sanskit Text: स इन्द्राय पवसे मत्सरिन्तमो यथा जेषाम समिथे तवोतयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa indrāya pavase matsarintamo yathā jeṣāma samithe tvotayaḥ ||
Translation: So, best of Cheerers, thou for Indra flowest on that we, with thy protection, may o’ercome in fight.

Sanskit Text: एष पर कोशे मधुमानचिक्रददिन्द्रस्य वज्रो वपुषो वपुष्टरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa pra kośe madhumānacikradadindrasya vajro vapuṣo vapuṣṭaraḥ |
Translation: 1. MORE beauteous than the beautiful, as Indra's bolt, this Soma, rich in sweets, hath clamoured in the vat.

Sanskit Text: अभीं रतस्य सुदुघा घर्तश्चुतो वाश्रा अर्षन्तिपयसेव धेनवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhīṃ ṛtasya sudughā ghṛtaścuto vāśrā arṣantipayaseva dhenavaḥ ||
Translation: Dropping with oil, abundant, streams of sacrifice flow unto him like milch-kine, lowing, with their milk.

Sanskit Text: स पूर्व्यः पवते यं दिवस परि शयेनो मथायदिषितस्तिरो रजः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pūrvyaḥ pavate yaṃ divas pari śyeno mathāyadiṣitastiro rajaḥ |
Translation: 2 On flows that Ancient One whom, hitherward, from heaven, sped through the region of the air, the Falcon snatched.

Sanskit Text: स मध्व आ युवते वेविजान इत कर्शानोरस्तुर्मनसाह बिभ्युषा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa madhva ā yuvate vevijāna it kṛśānorasturmanasāha bibhyuṣā ||
Translation: He, quivering with alarm and terrified in heart before bow-armed Kṛśānu, holdeth fast the sweet.

Sanskit Text: ते नः पूर्वास उपरास इन्दवो महे वाजाय धन्वन्तु गोमते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te naḥ pūrvāsa uparāsa indavo mahe vājāya dhanvantu ghomate |
Translation: 3 May those first freshest drops of Soma juice effused flow on, their way to bring us mighty strength in kine.

Sanskit Text: ईक्षेण्यासो अह्यो न चारवो बरह्म-बरह्म ये जुजुषुर्हविर हविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: īkṣeṇyāso ahyo na cāravo brahma-brahma ye jujuṣurhavir haviḥ ||
Translation: Beauteous as serpents, worthy to be looked upon, they whom each sacred gift and all our prayers have pleased.

Sanskit Text: अयं नो विद्वान वनवद वनुष्यत इन्दुः सत्राचा मनसा पुरुष्टुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ no vidvān vanavad vanuṣyata induḥ satrācā manasā puruṣṭutaḥ |
Translation: 4 May that much-lauded Indu, with a heart inclined to us, well-knowing, fight against our enemies.

Sanskit Text: इनस्य यः सदने गर्भमादधे गवामुरुब्जमभ्यर्षति वरजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: inasya yaḥ sadane gharbhamādadhe ghavāmurubjamabhyarṣati vrajam ||
Translation: He who hath brought the germ beside the Strong One's seat moves onward to the widely-opcned stall of kine.

Sanskit Text: चक्रिर्दिवः पवते कर्त्व्यो रसो महानदब्धो वरुणो हुरुग्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakrirdivaḥ pavate kṛtvyo raso mahānadabdho varuṇo hurughyate |
Translation: 5 The active potent juice of heaven is flowing on, great Varuṇa whom the forward man can ne’er deceive.

Sanskit Text: असावि मित्रो वर्जनेषु यज्ञियो.अत्यो न यूथे वर्षयुः कनिक्रदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asāvi mitro vṛjaneṣu yajñiyo.atyo na yūthe vṛṣayuḥ kanikradat ||
Translation: Mitra, the Holy, hath been pressed for troubled times, neighing like an impatient horse amid the herd,

Sanskit Text: पर राजा वाचं जनयन्नसिष्यददपो वसानो अभि गा इयक्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra rājā vācaṃ janayannasiṣyadadapo vasāno abhi ghā iyakṣati |
Translation: 1. RAISING his voice the King hath flowed upon his way: invested with the waters he would win the kine.

Sanskit Text: गर्भ्णाति रिप्रमविरस्य तान्वा शुद्धो देवानामुप याति निष्क्र्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛbhṇāti ripramavirasya tānvā śuddho devānāmupa yāti niṣkṛtam ||
Translation: The fleece retains his solid parts as though impure, and bright and cleansed he seeks the special place of Gods.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय सोम परि षिच्यसे नर्भिर्न्र्चक्षा ऊर्मिः कविरज्यसे वने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya soma pari ṣicyase nṛbhirnṛcakṣā ūrmiḥ kavirajyase vane |
Translation: 2 Thou, Soma, art effused for Indra by the men, balmed in the wood as wave, Sage, Viewer of mankind.

Sanskit Text: पूर्वीर्हि ते सरुतयः सन्ति यातवे सहस्रमश्वा हरयश्चमूषदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvīrhi te srutayaḥ santi yātave sahasramaśvā harayaścamūṣadaḥ ||
Translation: Full many are the paths whereon thou mayest go: a thousand bay steeds hast thou resting in the bowls.

Sanskit Text: समुद्रिया अप्सरसो मनीषिणमासीना अन्तरभि सोममक्षरन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samudriyā apsaraso manīṣiṇamāsīnā antarabhi somamakṣaran |
Translation: 3 Apsarases who dwell in waters of the sea, sitting within, have flowed to Soma wise of heart.

Sanskit Text: ता ईं हिन्वन्ति हर्म्यस्य सक्षणिं याचन्ते सुम्नं पवमानमक्षितम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā īṃ hinvanti harmyasya sakṣaṇiṃ yācante sumnaṃ pavamānamakṣitam ||
Translation: They urge the Master of the house upon his way, and to the Eternal Pavamana pray for bliss.

Sanskit Text: गोजिन नः सोमो रथजिद धिरण्यजित सवर्जिदब्जित पवते सहस्रजित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghojin naḥ somo rathajid dhiraṇyajit svarjidabjit pavate sahasrajit |
Translation: 4 Soma flows on for u's as winner of the kine, winner of thousands, cars, water, and light, and gold;

Sanskit Text: यं देवासश्चक्रिरे पीतये मदं सवादिष्ठं दरप्समरुणं मयोभुवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ devāsaścakrire pītaye madaṃ svādiṣṭhaṃ drapsamaruṇaṃ mayobhuvam ||
Translation: He whom the Gods have made a gladdening draught to drink, the drop most sweet to taste, weal-bringing, red of hue.

Sanskit Text: एतानि सोम पवमानो अस्मयुः सत्यानि कर्ण्वन दरविणान्यर्षसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etāni soma pavamāno asmayuḥ satyāni kṛṇvan draviṇānyarṣasi |
Translation: 5 Soma, as Pavamana thou, our faithful Friend, making for us these real treasures, flowest on.

Sanskit Text: जहि शत्रुमन्तिके दूरके च य उर्वीं गव्यूतिमभयं च नस कर्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jahi śatrumantike dūrake ca ya urvīṃ ghavyūtimabhayaṃ ca nas kṛdhi ||
Translation: Slay thou the enemy both near and,far away: grant us security and ample pasturage.

Sanskit Text: अचोदसो नो धन्वन्त्विन्दवः पर सुवानासो बर्हद्दिवेषु हरयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: acodaso no dhanvantvindavaḥ pra suvānāso bṛhaddiveṣu harayaḥ |
Translation: 1. SPONTANEOUS let our drops of Soma juice flow on, pressed, golden-hued, among the Gods of lofty heaven.

Sanskit Text: वि च नशन न इषो अरातयो.अर्यो नशन्त सनिषन्त नो धियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi ca naśan na iṣo arātayo.aryo naśanta saniṣanta no dhiyaḥ ||
Translation: Perish among us they who give no gifts of food! perish the godless! May our prayers obtain success.

Sanskit Text: पर णो धन्वन्त्विन्दवो मदच्युतो धना वा येभिरर्वतो जुनीमसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ṇo dhanvantvindavo madacyuto dhanā vā yebhirarvato junīmasi |
Translation: 2 Forward to us the drops, distilling meath, shall flow, like riches for whose sake we urge the horses on.

Sanskit Text: तिरो मर्तस्य कस्य चित परिह्व्र्तिं वयं धनानि विश्वधा भरेमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tiro martasya kasya cit parihvṛtiṃ vayaṃ dhanāni viśvadhā bharemahi ||
Translation: Beyond the crafty hindering of all mortal men may we continually bear precious wealth away.

Sanskit Text: उत सवस्या अरात्या अरिर्हि ष उतान्यस्या अरात्या वर्को हि षः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta svasyā arātyā arirhi ṣa utānyasyā arātyā vṛko hi ṣaḥ |
Translation: 3 Yea, yerily, foe of hate shown to himself is he, yea, verity, destroyer too of other hate.

Sanskit Text: धन्वन न तर्ष्णा समरीत तानभि सोम जहिपवमान दुराध्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhanvan na tṛṣṇā samarīta tānabhi soma jahipavamāna durādhyaḥ ||
Translation: As thirst subdueth in the desert, conquer thou, O Soma Pavarnana, men of evil thoughts.

Sanskit Text: दिवि ते नाभा परमो य आददे पर्थिव्यास्ते रुरुहुः सानविक्षिपः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divi te nābhā paramo ya ādade pṛthivyāste ruruhuḥ sānavikṣipaḥ |
Translation: 4 Near kin to thee is he, raised loftiest in the heavens: upon the earth's high ridge thy scions have grown forth.

Sanskit Text: अद्रयस्त्वा बप्सति गोरधि तवच्यप्सु तवा हस्तैर्दुदुहुर्मनीषिणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adrayastvā bapsati ghoradhi tvacyapsu tvā hastairduduhurmanīṣiṇaḥ ||
Translation: The press-stones chew and crunch thee on the ox's hide: sages have milked thee with their hands into the streams.

Sanskit Text: एवा त इन्दो सुभ्वं सुपेशसं रसं तुञ्जन्ति परथमा अभिश्रियः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā ta indo subhvaṃ supeśasaṃ rasaṃ tuñjanti prathamā abhiśriyaḥ |
Translation: 5 So do they hurry on thy strong and beauteous juice, O Indu, as the first ingredient of the draught.

Sanskit Text: निदं-निदं पवमान नि तारिष आविस्ते शुष्मो भवतु परियो मदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nidaṃ-nidaṃ pavamāna ni tāriṣa āviste śuṣmo bhavatu priyo madaḥ ||
Translation: Bring low, thou Pavamana, every single foe, and be thy might shown forth as sweet and gladdening drink.

Sanskit Text: सोमस्य धारा पवते नर्चक्षस रतेन देवान हवते दिवस परि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somasya dhārā pavate nṛcakṣasa ṛtena devān havate divas pari |
Translation: 1. ON flows the stream of Soma who beholds mankind: by everlasting Law he calls the Gods from heaven.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पते रवथेना वि दिद्युते समुद्रासो न सवनानि विव्यचुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspate ravathenā vi didyute samudrāso na savanāni vivyacuḥ ||
Translation: He lightens with the roaring of Br aspati: h the lakes have not contained the pourings of juice.

Sanskit Text: यं तवा वाजिन्नघ्न्या अभ्यनूषतायोहतं योनिमा रोहसि दयुमान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ tvā vājinnaghnyā abhyanūṣatāyohataṃ yonimā rohasi dyumān |
Translation: 2 Thou, powerful Soma, thou to whom the cows have -lowed, ascendest bright with sheen, thine iron-fashioned home.

Sanskit Text: मघोनामायुः परतिरन महि शरव इन्द्राय सोमपवसे वर्षा मदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maghonāmāyuḥ pratiran mahi śrava indrāya somapavase vṛṣā madaḥ ||
Translation: Thou, lengthening our princes' life and high renown, flowest for Indra as his might to gladdening drink.

Sanskit Text: एन्द्रस्य कुक्षा पवते मदिन्तम ऊर्जं वसानः शरवसे सुमङगलः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: endrasya kukṣā pavate madintama ūrjaṃ vasānaḥ śravase sumaṅghalaḥ |
Translation: 3 Best giver of delight, he flows to Indra's throat, robing himself in might, Auspicious One, for fame.

Sanskit Text: परत्यं स विश्वा भुवनाभि पप्रथे करीळन हरिरत्यः सयन्दते वर्षा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratyaṃ sa viśvā bhuvanābhi paprathe krīḷan hariratyaḥ syandate vṛṣā ||
Translation: He spreads himself abroad to meet all things that be: the vigorous Tawny Steed flows sporting on his way.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा देवेभ्यो मधुमत्तमं नरः सहस्रधारं दुहते दश कषिपः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā devebhyo madhumattamaṃ naraḥ sahasradhāraṃ duhate daśa kṣipaḥ |
Translation: 4 The men, the ten swift fingers, milk thee out for Gods, even thee most rich in meath, with thousand flowing streams.

Sanskit Text: नर्भिः सोम परच्युतो गरावभिः सुतो विश्वान्देवाना पवस्वा सहस्रजित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛbhiḥ soma pracyuto ghrāvabhiḥ suto viśvāndevānā pavasvā sahasrajit ||
Translation: Soma who winnest thousands, driven by the men, expressed with stones, bring, as thou flowest, all the Gods.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा हस्तिनो मधुमन्तमद्रिभिर्दुहन्त्यप्सु वर्षभन्दश कषिपः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā hastino madhumantamadribhirduhantyapsu vṛṣabhandaśa kṣipaḥ |
Translation: 5 Deft-handed men with stones, the ten swift fingers, drain thee into waters, thee, the Steer enriched with sweets.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं सोम मादयन दैव्यं जनं सिन्धोरिवोर्मिः पवमानो अर्षसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ soma mādayan daivyaṃ janaṃ sindhorivormiḥ pavamāno arṣasi ||
Translation: Thou, Soma, gladdening Indra, and the Heavenly Host, flowest as Pavamana like a river's wave.

Sanskit Text: पर सोमस्य पवमानस्योर्मय इन्द्रस्य यन्ति जठरं सुपेशसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra somasya pavamānasyormaya indrasya yanti jaṭharaṃ supeśasaḥ |
Translation: 1. ONWARD to Indra's throat move, beauteously adorned, the waves of Soma as he purifies himself,

Sanskit Text: दध्ना यदीमुन्नीता यशसा गवां दानाय शूरमुदमन्दिषुः सुताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhnā yadīmunnītā yaśasā ghavāṃ dānāya śūramudamandiṣuḥ sutāḥ ||
Translation: When they, brought forward with the lovely curd of kine, effused, have cheered the Hero to bestow his gifts.

Sanskit Text: अछा हि सोमः कलशानसिष्यददत्यो न वोळ्हा रघुवर्तनिर्व्र्षा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā hi somaḥ kalaśānasiṣyadadatyo na voḷhā raghuvartanirvṛṣā |
Translation: 2 Hither hath Soma flowed unto the beakers, like a chariot-horse, a stallion swift upon his way.

Sanskit Text: अथा देवानामुभयस्य जन्मनो विद्वानश्नोत्यमुत इतश्च यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā devānāmubhayasya janmano vidvānaśnotyamuta itaśca yat ||
Translation: Thus, knowing both the generations, he obtains the rights and dues of Gods from yonder and from hence.

Sanskit Text: आ नः सोम पवमानः किरा वस्विन्दो भव मघवा राधसो महः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā naḥ soma pavamānaḥ kirā vasvindo bhava maghavā rādhaso mahaḥ |
Translation: 3 While thou art cleansed, O Soma, scatter wealth on us; Indu, bestow great bounty as a liberal Prince.

Sanskit Text: शिक्षा वयोधो वसवे सु चेतुना मा नो गयमारे अस्मत परा सिचः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śikṣā vayodho vasave su cetunā mā no ghayamāre asmat parā sicaḥ ||
Translation: Giver of life, with wisdom help to opulence; strew not our home possessions far away from us.

Sanskit Text: आ नः पूषा पवमानः सुरातयो मित्रो गछन्तु वरुणः सजोषसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā naḥ pūṣā pavamānaḥ surātayo mitro ghachantu varuṇaḥ sajoṣasaḥ |
Translation: 4 Hither let Pūṣan Pavamana come to us, Varuṇa, Mitra, bountiful, of one accord,

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिर्मरुतो वायुरश्विना तवष्टा सविता सुयमा सरस्वती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatirmaruto vāyuraśvinā tvaṣṭā savitā suyamā sarasvatī ||
Translation: The Maruts, Aśvins, Vāyu, and Bṛhaspati, Savitar, Tvaṣṭar, tractable Sarasvatī.

Sanskit Text: उभे दयावाप्र्थिवी विश्वमिन्वे अर्यमा देवो अदितिर्विधाता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhe dyāvāpṛthivī viśvaminve aryamā devo aditirvidhātā |
Translation: 5 Both Heaven and Earth, the all-invigorating Pair, Vidhatar, Aditi, and Aryaman the God,

Sanskit Text: भगो नर्शंस उर्वन्तरिक्षं विश्वे देवाः पवमानंजुषन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhagho nṛśaṃsa urvantarikṣaṃ viśve devāḥ pavamānaṃjuṣanta ||
Translation: Bhaga who blesses men, the spacious Firmament,—let all the Gods in Pavamana take delight.

Sanskit Text: असावि सोमो अरुषो वर्षा हरी राजेव दस्मो अभि गा अचिक्रदत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asāvi somo aruṣo vṛṣā harī rājeva dasmo abhi ghā acikradat |
Translation: 1. EVEN as a King hath Soma, red and tawny Bull, been pressed: the Wondrous One hath bellowed to the kine.

Sanskit Text: पुनानो वारं पर्येत्यव्ययं शयेनो न योनिं घर्तवन्तमासदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punāno vāraṃ paryetyavyayaṃ śyeno na yoniṃ ghṛtavantamāsadam ||
Translation: While purified he passes through the filtering fleece to seat him hawk-like on the place that drops with oil.

Sanskit Text: कविर्वेधस्या पर्येषि माहिनमत्यो न मर्ष्टो अभि वाजमर्षसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kavirvedhasyā paryeṣi māhinamatyo na mṛṣṭo abhi vājamarṣasi |
Translation: 2. To glory goest thou, Sage with disposing skill, like a groomed steed thou rusbest forward to the prize.

Sanskit Text: अपसेधन दुरिता सोम मर्ळय घर्तं वसानः परियासि निर्णिजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apasedhan duritā soma mṛḷaya ghṛtaṃ vasānaḥ pariyāsi nirṇijam ||
Translation: O Soma, be thou gracious, driving off distress: thou goest, clothed in butter, to a robe of state.

Sanskit Text: पर्जन्यः पिता महिषस्य पर्णिनो नाभा पर्थिव्या गिरिषुक्षयं दधे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parjanyaḥ pitā mahiṣasya parṇino nābhā pṛthivyā ghiriṣukṣayaṃ dadhe |
Translation: 3 Parjanya is the Father of the Mighty Bird: on mountains, in earth's centre hath he made his home.

Sanskit Text: सवसार आपो अभि गा उतासरन सं गरावभिर्नसते वीते अध्वरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svasāra āpo abhi ghā utāsaran saṃ ghrāvabhirnasate vīte adhvare ||
Translation: The waters too have flowed, the Sisters, to the kine: he meets the pressing-stones at the beloved rite.

Sanskit Text: जायेव पत्यावधि शेव मंहसे पज्राया गर्भ शर्णुहि बरवीमि ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jāyeva patyāvadhi śeva maṃhase pajrāyā gharbha śṛṇuhi bravīmi te |
Translation: 4 Thou givest pleasure as a wife delights her lord. Listen, O Child of Pajri, for to thee I speak.

Sanskit Text: अन्तर्वाणीषु पर चरा सु जीवसे.अनिन्द्यो वर्जने सोम जाग्र्हि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: antarvāṇīṣu pra carā su jīvase.anindyo vṛjane soma jāghṛhi ||
Translation: Amid the holy songs go on that we may live: in time of trouble, Soma, watch thou free from blame.

Sanskit Text: यथा पूर्वेभ्यः शतसा अम्र्ध्रः सहस्रसाः पर्यया वाजमिन्दो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā pūrvebhyaḥ śatasā amṛdhraḥ sahasrasāḥ paryayā vājamindo |
Translation: 5 As to the men of old thou camest, Indu unharmed, to strengthen, winning hundreds, thousands,

Sanskit Text: एवा पवस्व सुविताय नव्यसे तव वरतमन्वापः सचन्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā pavasva suvitāya navyase tava vratamanvāpaḥ sacante ||
Translation: So now for new felicity flow onward: the waters follow as thy law ordaineth.

Sanskit Text: पवित्रं ते विततं बरह्मणस पते परभुर्गात्राणि पर्येषिविश्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavitraṃ te vitataṃ brahmaṇas pate prabhurghātrāṇi paryeṣiviśvataḥ |
Translation: 1. SPREAD is thy cleansing filter, Brahmaṇaspati: as Prince, thou enterest its limbs from every side.

Sanskit Text: अतप्ततनूर्न तदामो अश्नुते शर्तास इद वहन्तस्तत समाशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ataptatanūrna tadāmo aśnute śṛtāsa id vahantastat samāśata ||
Translation: The raw, whose mass hath not been heated gains not this: they only which are dressed, which bear, attain to it.

Sanskit Text: तपोष पवित्रं विततं दिवस पदे शोचन्तो अस्य तन्तवो वयस्थिरन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tapoṣ pavitraṃ vitataṃ divas pade śocanto asya tantavo vyasthiran |
Translation: 2 High in the seat of heaven is spread the Scorcher's sieve: its threads are standing separate, glittering with light.

Sanskit Text: अवन्त्यस्य पवीतारमाशवो दिवस पर्ष्ठमधितिष्ठन्ति चेतसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avantyasya pavītāramāśavo divas pṛṣṭhamadhitiṣṭhanti cetasā ||
Translation: The Swift Ones favour him who purifieth this: with consciousness they stand upon the height of heaven.

Sanskit Text: अरूरुचदुषसः पर्श्निरग्रिय उक्षा बिभर्ति भुवनानि वाजयुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arūrucaduṣasaḥ pṛśniraghriya ukṣā bibharti bhuvanāni vājayuḥ |
Translation: 3 The foremost spotted Steer hath made the Mornings shine, and yearning after strength sustains all things that be.

Sanskit Text: मायाविनो ममिरे अस्य मायया नर्चक्षसः पितरो गर्भमा दधुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: māyāvino mamire asya māyayā nṛcakṣasaḥ pitaro gharbhamā dadhuḥ ||
Translation: By his high wisdom have the mighty Sages wrought: the Fathers who behold mankind laid down the germ,

Sanskit Text: गन्धर्व इत्था पदमस्य रक्षति पाति देवानां जनिमान्यद्भुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghandharva itthā padamasya rakṣati pāti devānāṃ janimānyadbhutaḥ |
Translation: 4 Gandharva verily protects his dwellingplace; Wondrous, he guards the generations of the Gods.

Sanskit Text: गर्भ्णाति रिपुं निधया निधापतिः सुक्र्त्तमा मधुनो भक्षमाशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛbhṇāti ripuṃ nidhayā nidhāpatiḥ sukṛttamā madhuno bhakṣamāśata ||
Translation: Lord of the snare, he takes the foeman with the snare: those who are most devout have gained a share of meath.

Sanskit Text: हविर्हविष्मो महि सद्म दैव्यं नभो वसानः परि यास्यध्वरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: havirhaviṣmo mahi sadma daivyaṃ nabho vasānaḥ pari yāsyadhvaram |
Translation: 5 Rich in oblations! robed in cloud, thou corapassest oblation, sacrifice, the mighty seat of Gods.

Sanskit Text: राजा पवित्ररथो वाजमारुहः सहस्रभ्र्ष्टिर्जयसि शरवो बर्हत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājā pavitraratho vājamāruhaḥ sahasrabhṛṣṭirjayasi śravo bṛhat ||
Translation: King, on thy chariot-sieve thou goest up to war, and with a thousand weapons winnest lofty fame.

Sanskit Text: पवस्व देवमादनो विचर्षणिरप्सा इन्द्राय वरुणाय वायवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva devamādano vicarṣaṇirapsā indrāya varuṇāya vāyave |
Translation: 1. FLOW, cheering Gods, most active, winner of the flood, for Indra, and for Vāyu, and for Varuṇa.

Sanskit Text: कर्धी नो अद्य वरिवः सवस्तिमदुरुक्षितौ गर्णीहि दैव्यं जनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛdhī no adya varivaḥ svastimadurukṣitau ghṛṇīhi daivyaṃ janam ||
Translation: Bestow on us to-day wide room with happiness, and in tbine ample dwelling laud the Host of Heaven.

Sanskit Text: आ यस्तस्थौ भुवनान्यमर्त्यो विश्वानि सोमः परि तान्यर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yastasthau bhuvanānyamartyo viśvāni somaḥ pari tānyarṣati |
Translation: 2 He who hath come anear to creatures that have life, Immortal Soma flows onward to all of them.

Sanskit Text: कर्ण्वन संच्र्तं विच्र्तमभिष्टय इन्दुः सिषक्त्युषसं न सूर्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṇvan saṃcṛtaṃ vicṛtamabhiṣṭaya induḥ siṣaktyuṣasaṃ na sūryaḥ ||
Translation: Effecting, for our aid, both union and release, Indu, like Sūrya, follows closely after Dawn.

Sanskit Text: आ यो गोभिः सर्ज्यत ओषधीष्वा देवानां सुम्न इषयन्नुपावसुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yo ghobhiḥ sṛjyata oṣadhīṣvā devānāṃ sumna iṣayannupāvasuḥ |
Translation: 3 He who is poured with milk, he who within the plants hastes bringing treasure for the happiness of Gods,

Sanskit Text: आ विद्युता पवते धारया सुत इन्द्रं सोमो मादयन दैव्यं जनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vidyutā pavate dhārayā suta indraṃ somo mādayan daivyaṃ janam ||
Translation: He, poured forth in a stream flows with the lightning's flash, Soma who gladdens Indra and the Host of Heaven.

Sanskit Text: एष सय सोमः पवते सहस्रजिद धिन्वानो वाचमिषिरामुषर्बुधम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa sya somaḥ pavate sahasrajid dhinvāno vācamiṣirāmuṣarbudham |
Translation: 4 Winner of thousands, he, this Soma, flows along, raising a vigorous voice that wakens with the dawn.

Sanskit Text: इन्दुः समुद्रमुदियर्ति वायुभिरेन्द्रस्य हार्दिकलशेषु सीदति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: induḥ samudramudiyarti vāyubhirendrasya hārdikalaśeṣu sīdati ||
Translation: Indu with winds drives on the ocean of the air, he sinks within the jars, he rests in Indra's heart.

Sanskit Text: अभि तयं गावः पयसा पयोव्र्धं सोमं शरीणन्ति मतिभिः सवर्विदम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tyaṃ ghāvaḥ payasā payovṛdhaṃ somaṃ śrīṇanti matibhiḥ svarvidam |
Translation: 5 The kine with milk dress him who makes the milk increase, Soma, amid the songs, who finds the light of heaven.

Sanskit Text: धनंजयः पवते कर्त्व्यो रसो विप्रः कविःकाव्येना सवर्चनाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhanaṃjayaḥ pavate kṛtvyo raso vipraḥ kaviḥkāvyenā svarcanāḥ ||
Translation: Winner of wealth, the effectual juice is flowing on, Singer and Sage by wisdom, dear as heaven itself.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय सोम सुषुतः परि सरवापामीवा भवतु रक्षसा सह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya soma suṣutaḥ pari sravāpāmīvā bhavatu rakṣasā saha |
Translation: 1. FLOW on to Indra, Soma, carefully effused: let sickness stay afar together with the fiends.

Sanskit Text: मा ते रसस्य मत्सत दवयाविनो दरविणस्वन्त इह सन्त्विन्दवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā te rasasya matsata dvayāvino draviṇasvanta iha santvindavaḥ ||
Translation: Let not the double-tongued delight them with thy juice. here be thy flowing drops laden with opulence.

Sanskit Text: अस्मान समर्ये पवमान चोदय दक्षो देवानामसि हि परियो मदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmān samarye pavamāna codaya dakṣo devānāmasi hi priyo madaḥ |
Translation: 2 O Pavamana, urge us forward in the fight thou art the vigour of the Gods, the well-loved drink.

Sanskit Text: जहि शत्रून्रभ्या भन्दनायतः पिबेन्द्र सोममव नो मर्धो जहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jahi śatrūnrabhyā bhandanāyataḥ pibendra somamava no mṛdho jahi ||
Translation: Smite thou our enemies who raise the shout of joy: Indra, drink Soma juice, and drive away our foes.

Sanskit Text: अदब्ध इन्दो पवसे मदिन्तम आत्मेन्द्रस्य भवसि धासिरुत्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adabdha indo pavase madintama ātmendrasya bhavasi dhāsiruttamaḥ |
Translation: 3 Unharmed, best Cheerer, thou, O Indu, flowest on: thou, even thou thyself, art Indra's noblest food.

Sanskit Text: अभि सवरन्ति बहवो मनीषिणो राजानमस्य भुवनस्यनिंसते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi svaranti bahavo manīṣiṇo rājānamasya bhuvanasyaniṃsate ||
Translation: Full many a wise man lifts to thee the song of praise, and hails thee with a kiss as Sovran of this world.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रणीथः शतधारो अद्भुत इन्द्रायेन्दुः पवते काम्यं मधु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasraṇīthaḥ śatadhāro adbhuta indrāyenduḥ pavate kāmyaṃ madhu |
Translation: 4 Wondrous, with hundred streams, hymned in a thousand songs, Indu pours out for Indra his delightrul meath.

Sanskit Text: जयन कषेत्रमभ्यर्षा जयन्नप उरुं नो गातुं कर्णु सोम मीढ्वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jayan kṣetramabhyarṣā jayannapa uruṃ no ghātuṃ kṛṇu soma mīḍhvaḥ ||
Translation: Winning us land and waters, flow thou hitherward: Rainer of bounties, Soma, make broad way for us.

Sanskit Text: कनिक्रदत कलशे गोभिरज्यसे वयव्ययं समया वारमर्षसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kanikradat kalaśe ghobhirajyase vyavyayaṃ samayā vāramarṣasi |
Translation: 5 Roaring within the beaker thou art balmed with milk: thou passest through the fleecy filter all at once.

Sanskit Text: मर्म्र्ज्यमानो अत्यो न सानसिरिन्द्रस्य सोम जठरे समक्षरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: marmṛjyamāno atyo na sānasirindrasya soma jaṭhare samakṣaraḥ ||
Translation: Carefully cleansed and decked like a prizewinning steed, O Soma, thou hast flowed down within Indra's throat.

Sanskit Text: सवादुः पवस्व दिव्याय जन्मने सवादुरिन्द्राय सुहवीतुनाम्ने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāduḥ pavasva divyāya janmane svādurindrāya suhavītunāmne |
Translation: 6 Flow onward sweet of flavour for the Heavenly Race, for Indra sweet, whose name is easily invoked:

Sanskit Text: सवादुर्मित्राय वरुणाय वायवे बर्हस्पतये मधुमानदाभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svādurmitrāya varuṇāya vāyave bṛhaspataye madhumānadābhyaḥ ||
Translation: Flow sweet for Mitra, Varuṇa, and Vāyu, rich in meath, inviolable for Bṛhaspati.

Sanskit Text: अत्यं मर्जन्ति कलशे दश कषिपः पर विप्राणां मतयो वाच ईरते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atyaṃ mṛjanti kalaśe daśa kṣipaḥ pra viprāṇāṃ matayo vāca īrate |
Translation: 7 Ten rapid fingers deck the Courser in the jar: with hymns the holy singers send their voices forth.

Sanskit Text: पवमाना अभ्यर्षन्ति सुष्टुतिमेन्द्रं विशन्तिमदिरास इन्दवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamānā abhyarṣanti suṣṭutimendraṃ viśantimadirāsa indavaḥ ||
Translation: The filtering juices hasten to their eulogy, the drops that gladden find their way to Indra's heart.

Sanskit Text: पवमानो अभ्यर्षा सुवीर्यमुर्वीं गव्यूतिं महि शर्म सप्रथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamāno abhyarṣā suvīryamurvīṃ ghavyūtiṃ mahi śarma saprathaḥ |
Translation: 8 While thou art purified pour on us hero strength, great, far-extended shelter, spacious pasturage.

Sanskit Text: माकिर्नो अस्य परिषूतिरीशतेन्दो जयेम तवयाधनं-धनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mākirno asya pariṣūtirīśatendo jayema tvayādhanaṃ-dhanam ||
Translation: Let no oppression master this our holy work: may we, O Indu, gain all opulence through thee.

Sanskit Text: अधि दयामस्थाद वर्षभो विचक्षणो.अरूरुचद वि दिवो रोचना कविः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi dyāmasthād vṛṣabho vicakṣaṇo.arūrucad vi divo rocanā kaviḥ |
Translation: 9 The Steer who sees afar hath risen above the sky: the Sage hath caused the lights of heaven to give their shine.

Sanskit Text: राजा पवित्रमत्येति रोरुवद दिवः पीयूषन्दुहते नर्चक्षसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājā pavitramatyeti roruvad divaḥ pīyūṣanduhate nṛcakṣasaḥ ||
Translation: The. King is passing through the filter with a roar: they drain the milk of heaven from him who looks on men.

Sanskit Text: दिवो नाके मधुजिह्वा असश्चतो वेना दुहन्त्युक्षणं गिरिष्ठाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo nāke madhujihvā asaścato venā duhantyukṣaṇaṃ ghiriṣṭhām |
Translation: 10 High in the vault of heaven, unceasing, honey-tongued, the Loving Ones drain out the mountain-haunting Steer,—

Sanskit Text: अप्सु दरप्सं वाव्र्धानं समुद्र आ सिन्धोरूर्मामधुमन्तं पवित्र आ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apsu drapsaṃ vāvṛdhānaṃ samudra ā sindhorūrmāmadhumantaṃ pavitra ā ||
Translation: The drop that hath grown great in waters, in the lake meath-rich, in the stream's wave and in the cleansing sieve.

Sanskit Text: नाके सुपर्णमुपपप्तिवांसं गिरो वेनानामक्र्पन्त पूर्वीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāke suparṇamupapaptivāṃsaṃ ghiro venānāmakṛpanta pūrvīḥ |
Translation: 11 The Loving Ones besought with many voices the Eagle who had flown away to heaven.

Sanskit Text: शिशुं रिहन्ति मतयः पनिप्नतं हिरण्ययं शकुनं कषामणि सथाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śiśuṃ rihanti matayaḥ panipnataṃ hiraṇyayaṃ śakunaṃ kṣāmaṇi sthām ||
Translation: Hymns kiss the Youngling worthy of laudation, resting on earth, the Bird of golden colour.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वो गन्धर्वो अधि नाके अस्थाद विश्वा रूपा परतिचक्षाणो अस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvo ghandharvo adhi nāke asthād viśvā rūpā praticakṣāṇo asya |
Translation: 12 High to heaven's vault hath the Gandharva risen, beholding all his varied forms and figures.

Sanskit Text: भानुः शुक्रेण शोचिषा वयद्यौत परारूरुचद रोदसी मातरा शुचिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhānuḥ śukreṇa śociṣā vyadyaut prārūrucad rodasī mātarā śuciḥ ||
Translation: His ray hath shone abroad with gleaming splendour: pure, he hath lighted both the worlds, the Parents.

Sanskit Text: पर त आशवः पवमान धीजवो मदा अर्षन्ति रघुजा इव तमना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ta āśavaḥ pavamāna dhījavo madā arṣanti raghujā iva tmanā |
Translation: 1. THY gladdening draughts, O Pavamana, urged by song flow swiftly of themselves like sons of fleet-foot mares.

Sanskit Text: दिव्याः सुपर्णा मधुमन्त इन्दवो मदिन्तमासः परि कोशमासते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divyāḥ suparṇā madhumanta indavo madintamāsaḥ pari kośamāsate ||
Translation: The drops of Soma juice, those eagles of the heavens, most cheering, rich in meath, rest in the reservoir.

Sanskit Text: पर ते मदासो मदिरास आशवो.अस्र्क्षत रथ्यासो यथा पर्थक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te madāso madirāsa āśavo.asṛkṣata rathyāso yathā pṛthak |
Translation: 2 As rapid chariot-steeds, so turned in several ways have thine exhilarating juices darted forth,

Sanskit Text: धेनुर्न वत्सं पयसाभि वज्रिणमिन्द्रमिन्दवो मधुमन्त ऊर्मयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhenurna vatsaṃ payasābhi vajriṇamindramindavo madhumanta ūrmayaḥ ||
Translation: Soma-drops rich in meath, waves, to the Thunder-armed, to Indra, like milch-kine who seek their calf with milk.

Sanskit Text: अत्यो न हियानो अभि वाजमर्ष सवर्वित कोशं दिवो अद्रिमातरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atyo na hiyāno abhi vājamarṣa svarvit kośaṃ divo adrimātaram |
Translation: 3 Like a steed urged to battle, finder of the light; speed onward to the cloud-born reservoir of heaven,

Sanskit Text: वर्षा पवित्रे अधि सानो अव्यये सोमः पुनान इन्द्रियाय धायसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā pavitre adhi sāno avyaye somaḥ punāna indriyāya dhāyase ||
Translation: A Steer that o’er the woolly surface seeks the sieve, Soma while purified for Indra's nourishment.

Sanskit Text: पर त आश्विनीः पवमान धीजुवो दिव्या अस्र्ग्रन पयसा धरीमणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ta āśvinīḥ pavamāna dhījuvo divyā asṛghran payasā dharīmaṇi |
Translation: 4 Fleet as swift steeds, thy drops, divine, thought-swift, have been, O Pavamana, poured with milk into the vat.

Sanskit Text: परान्तरषयः सथाविरीरस्र्क्षत ये तवा मर्जन्त्य रषिषाण वेधसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāntarṣayaḥ sthāvirīrasṛkṣata ye tvā mṛjanty ṛṣiṣāṇa vedhasaḥ ||
Translation: The Ṛṣis have poured in continuous Soma drops, ordainers who adorn thee, Friend whom Ṛṣis love.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा धामानि विश्वचक्ष रभ्वसः परभोस्ते सतः परियन्ति केतवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā dhāmāni viśvacakṣa ṛbhvasaḥ prabhoste sataḥ pariyanti ketavaḥ |
Translation: 5 O thou who seest all things, Sovran as thou art and passing strong, thy rays encompass all abodes.

Sanskit Text: वयानशिः पवसे सोम धर्मभिः पतिर्विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyānaśiḥ pavase soma dharmabhiḥ patirviśvasya bhuvanasya rājasi ||
Translation: Pervading with thy natural powers thou flowest on, and as the whole world's Lord, O Soma, thou art King.

Sanskit Text: उभयतः पवमानस्य रश्मयो धरुवस्य सतः परि यन्ति केतवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhayataḥ pavamānasya raśmayo dhruvasya sataḥ pari yanti ketavaḥ |
Translation: 6 The beams of Pavamana, sent from earth and heaven, his ensigns who is ever steadfast, travel round.

Sanskit Text: यदी पवित्रे अधि मर्ज्यते हरिः सत्ता नि योना कलशेषु सीदति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadī pavitre adhi mṛjyate hariḥ sattā ni yonā kalaśeṣu sīdati ||
Translation: When on the sieve the Golden-hued is cleansed, he rests within the vats as one who seats him in his place.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञस्य केतुः पवते सवध्वरः सोमो देवानामुप याति निष्क्र्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñasya ketuḥ pavate svadhvaraḥ somo devānāmupa yāti niṣkṛtam |
Translation: 7 Served with fair rites he flows, ensign of sacrifice: Soma advances to the special place of Gods.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रधारः परि कोशमर्षति वर्षा पवित्रमत्येति रोरुवत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasradhāraḥ pari kośamarṣati vṛṣā pavitramatyeti roruvat ||
Translation: He speeds with thousand currents to the reservoir, and passes through the filter bellowing as a bull.

Sanskit Text: राजा समुद्रं नद्यो वि गाहते.अपामूर्मिं सचते सिन्धुषु शरितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājā samudraṃ nadyo vi ghāhate.apāmūrmiṃ sacate sindhuṣu śritaḥ |
Translation: 8 The Sovran dips him in the seain and the streams, and set in rivers with the waters' wave moves on.

Sanskit Text: अध्यस्थात सानु पवमानो अव्ययं नाभा पर्थिव्या धरुणो महो दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhyasthāt sānu pavamāno avyayaṃ nābhā pṛthivyā dharuṇo maho divaḥ ||
Translation: High heaven's Sustainer at the central point of earth, raised on the fleecy surface Pavamana stands.

Sanskit Text: दिवो न सानु सतनयन्नचिक्रदद दयौश्च यस्य पर्थिवी च धर्मभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo na sānu stanayannacikradad dyauśca yasya pṛthivī ca dharmabhiḥ |
Translation: 9 He on whose high decree the heavens and earth depend nath roared and thundered like the summit of the sky.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य सख्यं पवते विवेविदत सोमः पुनानःकलशेषु सीदति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya sakhyaṃ pavate vivevidat somaḥ punānaḥkalaśeṣu sīdati ||
Translation: Soma flows on obtaining Indra's friendly love, and, as they purify him, settles in the jars.

Sanskit Text: जयोतिर्यज्ञस्य पवते मधु परियं पिता देवानां जनिता विभूवसुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyotiryajñasya pavate madhu priyaṃ pitā devānāṃ janitā vibhūvasuḥ |
Translation: 10 He, light of sacrifice distils delicious meath, most wealthy, Father and begetter of the Gods.

Sanskit Text: दधाति रत्नं सवधयोरपीच्यं मदिन्तमो मत्सर इन्द्रियो रसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhāti ratnaṃ svadhayorapīcyaṃ madintamo matsara indriyo rasaḥ ||
Translation: He, gladdening, best of Cheerers, juice!hat Indra loves, enriches with mysterious treasure earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: अभिक्रन्दन कलशं वाज्यर्षति पतिर्दिवः शतधारो विचक्षणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhikrandan kalaśaṃ vājyarṣati patirdivaḥ śatadhāro vicakṣaṇaḥ |
Translation: 11 The vigorous and far-seeing one, the Lord of heaven, flows, shouting to the beaker, with his thousand streams.

Sanskit Text: हरिर्मित्रस्य सदनेषु सीदति मर्म्र्जानो.अविभिःसिन्धुभिर्व्र्षा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: harirmitrasya sadaneṣu sīdati marmṛjāno.avibhiḥsindhubhirvṛṣā ||
Translation: Coloured like gold he rests in seats where Mitra dwells, the Steer made beautiful by rivers and by sheep.

Sanskit Text: अग्रे सिन्धूनां पवमानो अर्षत्यग्रे वाचो अग्रियो गोषु गछति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghre sindhūnāṃ pavamāno arṣatyaghre vāco aghriyo ghoṣu ghachati |
Translation: 12 In forefront of the rivers Pavamana speeds, in forefront of the hymn, foremost among the kine.

Sanskit Text: अग्रे वाजस्य भजते महाधनं सवायुधः सोत्र्भिः पूयते वर्षा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghre vājasya bhajate mahādhanaṃ svāyudhaḥ sotṛbhiḥ pūyate vṛṣā ||
Translation: He shares the mighty booty in the van of war: the well-armed Steer is purified by worshippers.

Sanskit Text: अयं मतवाञ्छकुनो यथा हितो.अव्ये ससार पवमान ऊर्मिणा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ matavāñchakuno yathā hito.avye sasāra pavamāna ūrmiṇā |
Translation: 13 This heedful Pavamana, like a bird sent forth, hath with his wave flowed onward to the fleecy sieve.

Sanskit Text: तव करत्वा रोदसी अन्तरा कवे शुचिर्धिया पवते सोम इन्द्र ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava kratvā rodasī antarā kave śucirdhiyā pavate soma indra te ||
Translation: O Indra, through thy wisdom, b thy thought, O Sage, Soma flows bright and pure between the earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: दरापिं वसानो यजतो दिविस्प्र्शमन्तरिक्षप्रा भुवनेष्वर्पितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: drāpiṃ vasāno yajato divispṛśamantarikṣaprā bhuvaneṣvarpitaḥ |
Translation: 14 He, clad in mail that reaches heaven, the Holy One, filling the firmament stationed amid the worlds,

Sanskit Text: सवर्जज्ञानो नभसाभ्यक्रमीत परत्नमस्य पितरमा विवासति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svarjajñāno nabhasābhyakramīt pratnamasya pitaramā vivāsati ||
Translation: Knowing. the realm of light, hath come to us in rain: he summons to himself his own primeval Sire.

Sanskit Text: सो अस्य विशे महि शर्म यछति यो अस्य धाम परथमं वयानशे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: so asya viśe mahi śarma yachati yo asya dhāma prathamaṃ vyānaśe |
Translation: 15 He who was first of all to penetrate his form bestowed upon his race wide shelter and defence.

Sanskit Text: पदं यदस्य परमे वयोमन्यतो विश्वा अभि संयाति संयतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: padaṃ yadasya parame vyomanyato viśvā abhi saṃyāti saṃyataḥ ||
Translation: From that high station which he hath in loftiest heaven he comes victorious to all encounters here.

Sanskit Text: परो अयासीदिन्दुरिन्द्रस्य निष्क्र्तं सखा सख्युर्न पर मिनाति संगिरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pro ayāsīdindurindrasya niṣkṛtaṃ sakhā sakhyurna pra mināti saṃghiram |
Translation: 16 Indu hath started for Indra's special place and slights not as a Friend the promise of his Friend.

Sanskit Text: मर्य इव युवतिभिः समर्षति सोमः कलशे शतयाम्ना पथा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: marya iva yuvatibhiḥ samarṣati somaḥ kalaśe śatayāmnā pathā ||
Translation: Soma speeds onward like a youth to youtlitial maids, and gains the beaker by a course of bundred paths.

Sanskit Text: पर वो धियो मन्द्रयुवो विपन्युवः पनस्युवः संवसनेष्वक्रमुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vo dhiyo mandrayuvo vipanyuvaḥ panasyuvaḥ saṃvasaneṣvakramuḥ |
Translation: 17 Your songs, exhilarating, tuneful, uttering praise, are come into the placns where the people meet.

Sanskit Text: सोमं मनीषा अभ्यनूषत सतुभो.अभि धेनवः पयसेमशिश्रयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaṃ manīṣā abhyanūṣata stubho.abhi dhenavaḥ payasemaśiśrayuḥ ||
Translation: Worshippers have exalted Soma with their hymns, and milch kine have come near to meet him with their milk.

Sanskit Text: आ नः सोम संयतं पिप्युशीमिषमिन्दो पवस्व पवमानोस्रिधम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā naḥ soma saṃyataṃ pipyuśīmiṣamindo pavasva pavamānoasridham |
Translation: 18 O Soma, Indu, while they cleanse thee, pour on us accumulateds Plentiful, nutritious food,

Sanskit Text: या नो दोहते तरिरहन्नसश्चुषी कषुमद वाजवन मधुमद सुवीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā no dohate trirahannasaścuṣī kṣumad vājavan madhumad suvīryam ||
Translation: Which, ceaseless, thrice a day shall yield us hero power enriched with store of nourishment, and strength, and Meath.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा मतीनां पवते विचक्षणः सोमो अह्नः परतरीतोषसो दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā matīnāṃ pavate vicakṣaṇaḥ somo ahnaḥ pratarītoṣaso divaḥ |
Translation: 19 Far-seeing Soma flows, the Steer, the Lord of hymns, the Furtherer of day, of morning, and of heaven.

Sanskit Text: कराणा सिन्धूनां कलशानवीवशदिन्द्रस्य हार्द्याविशन मनीषिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: krāṇā sindhūnāṃ kalaśānavīvaśadindrasya hārdyāviśan manīṣibhiḥ ||
Translation: Mixt with the streams he caused the beakers to resound, and with the singers' aid they entered Indra's heart.

Sanskit Text: मनीषिभिः पवते पूर्व्यः कविर्न्र्भिर्यतः परि कोशानचिक्रदत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: manīṣibhiḥ pavate pūrvyaḥ kavirnṛbhiryataḥ pari kośānacikradat |
Translation: 20 On, with the prudent singers, flows the ancient Sage and guided by the men hath roared about the vats.

Sanskit Text: तरितस्य नाम जनयन मधु कषरदिन्द्रस्य वायोः सख्याय कर्तवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tritasya nāma janayan madhu kṣaradindrasya vāyoḥ sakhyāya kartave ||
Translation: Producing Trita's name, may he pour forth the meath, that Vāyu and that Indra may become his Friends.

Sanskit Text: अयं पुनान उषसो वि रोचयदयं सिन्धुभ्यो अभवदु लोकक्र्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ punāna uṣaso vi rocayadayaṃ sindhubhyo abhavadu lokakṛt |
Translation: 21 He, being purified, hath made the Mornings shine: this, even this is he who gave the rivers room.

Sanskit Text: अयं तरिः सप्त दुदुहान आशिरं सोमो हर्दे पवते चारु मत्सरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ triḥ sapta duduhāna āśiraṃ somo hṛde pavate cāru matsaraḥ ||
Translation: He made the Three Times Seven pour out the milky flow: Soma, the Cheerer, yields whate’er the heart finds sweet.

Sanskit Text: पवस्व सोम दिव्येषु धामसु सर्जान इन्दो कलशे पवित्र आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva soma divyeṣu dhāmasu sṛjāna indo kalaśe pavitra ā |
Translation: 22 Flow, onward, Soma, in thine own celestial forms, flow, Indu, poured within the beaker and the sieve.

Sanskit Text: सीदन्निन्द्रस्य जठरे कनिक्रदन नर्भिर्यतः सूर्यमारोहयो दिवि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sīdannindrasya jaṭhare kanikradan nṛbhiryataḥ sūryamārohayo divi ||
Translation: Sinking into the throat of Indra with a roar, led by the men thou madest Sūrya mount to heaven.

Sanskit Text: अद्रिभिः सुतः पवसे पवित्र आ इन्दविन्द्रस्य जठरेष्वाविशन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adribhiḥ sutaḥ pavase pavitra ā indavindrasya jaṭhareṣvāviśan |
Translation: 23 Pressed out with stones thou flowest onward to the sieve, O Indu, entering the depths of Indra's throat.

Sanskit Text: तवं नर्चक्षा अभवो विचक्षण सोम गोत्रमङगिरोभ्यो.अव्र्णोरप ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ nṛcakṣā abhavo vicakṣaṇa soma ghotramaṅghirobhyo.avṛṇorapa ||
Translation: Far-sighted Soma, now thou lookest on mankind: thou didst unbar the cowstall for the Aṅgirases.

Sanskit Text: तवां सोम पवमानं सवाध्यो.अनु विप्रासो अमदन्नवस्यवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ soma pavamānaṃ svādhyo.anu viprāso amadannavasyavaḥ |
Translation: 24 In thee, O Soma, while thou purifitedst thee, high-thoughted sages, seeking favour, have rejoiced.

Sanskit Text: तवां सुपर्ण आभरद दिवस परीन्दो विश्वाभिर्मतिभिः परिष्क्र्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ suparṇa ābharad divas parīndo viśvābhirmatibhiḥ pariṣkṛtam ||
Translation: Down from the heavens the Falcon brought thee hitherward, even thee, O Indu, thee whom all our hymns adorn.

Sanskit Text: अव्ये पुनानं परि वार ऊर्मिणा हरिं नवन्ते अभि सप्त धेनवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avye punānaṃ pari vāra ūrmiṇā hariṃ navante abhi sapta dhenavaḥ |
Translation: 25 Seven Milch-kine glorify the Tawny-coloured One while with his wave in wool he purifies himself.

Sanskit Text: अपामुपस्थे अध्यायवः कविं रतस्य योना महिषा अहेषत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāmupasthe adhyāyavaḥ kaviṃ ṛtasya yonā mahiṣā aheṣata ||
Translation: The living men, the mighty, have impelled the Sage into the waters' lap, the place of sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: इन्दुः पुनानो अति गाहते मर्धो विश्वानि कर्ण्वन सुपथानि यज्यवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: induḥ punāno ati ghāhate mṛdho viśvāni kṛṇvan supathāni yajyave |
Translation: 26 Indu, attaining purity, plunges through the foe, making Ilis ways all easy for the pious man.

Sanskit Text: गाः कर्ण्वानो निर्णिजं हर्यतः कविरत्यो न करीळन परि वारमर्षति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāḥ kṛṇvāno nirṇijaṃ haryataḥ kaviratyo na krīḷan pari vāramarṣati ||
Translation: Making the kine his mantle, he, the lovely Sage, runs like a sporting courser onward through the fleece.

Sanskit Text: असश्चतः शतधारा अभिश्रियो हरिं नवन्ते.अव ता उदन्युवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asaścataḥ śatadhārā abhiśriyo hariṃ navante.ava tā udanyuvaḥ |
Translation: 27 The ceaseless watery fountains with their hundred streams sing, as they hasten near, to him the Golden-hued

Sanskit Text: कषिपो मर्जन्ति परि गोभिराव्र्तं तर्तीये पर्ष्ठे अधि रोचने दिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣipo mṛjanti pari ghobhirāvṛtaṃ tṛtīye pṛṣṭhe adhi rocane divaḥ ||
Translation: Him, clad in robes of milk, swift fingers beautify on the third height and in the luminous realm of heaven.

Sanskit Text: तवेमाः परजा दिव्यस्य रेतसस्त्वं विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tavemāḥ prajā divyasya retasastvaṃ viśvasya bhuvanasya rājasi |
Translation: 28 These are thy generations of celestial seed thou art the Sovran Lord of all the world of life.

Sanskit Text: अथेदं विश्वं पवमान ते वशे तवमिन्दो परथमोधामधा असि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athedaṃ viśvaṃ pavamāna te vaśe tvamindo prathamodhāmadhā asi ||
Translation: This universe, O Pavamana, owns thy sway; thou, Indu, art the first establisher of Law.

Sanskit Text: तवं समुद्रो असि विश्ववित कवे तवेमाः पञ्च परदिशो विधर्मणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ samudro asi viśvavit kave tavemāḥ pañca pradiśo vidharmaṇi |
Translation: 29 Thou art the sea, O Sage who bringest alf to light: under thy Law are these five regions of the world.

Sanskit Text: तवं दयां च पर्थिवीं चाति जभ्रिषे तव जयोतींषि पवमान सूर्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ dyāṃ ca pṛthivīṃ cāti jabhriṣe tava jyotīṃṣi pavamāna sūryaḥ ||
Translation: Tlou reachest out beyond the earth, beyond the heavens: thine are the lights, O Pavamana, thine the Sun.

Sanskit Text: तवं पवित्रे रजसो विधर्मणि देवेभ्यः सोम पवमान पूयसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ pavitre rajaso vidharmaṇi devebhyaḥ soma pavamāna pūyase |
Translation: 30 Thou in the filter, Soma Pavamana, art purified to support the region for the Gods.

Sanskit Text: तवामुशिजः परथमा अग्र्भ्णत तुभ्येमा विश्वा भुवनानि येमिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmuśijaḥ prathamā aghṛbhṇata tubhyemā viśvā bhuvanāni yemire ||
Translation: The chief, the longing ones have sought to hold thee fast, and all these living creatures have been turned to thee.

Sanskit Text: पर रेभ एत्यति वारमव्ययं वर्षा वनेष्वव चक्रदद्धरिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra rebha etyati vāramavyayaṃ vṛṣā vaneṣvava cakradaddhariḥ |
Translation: 31 Onward the Singer travels o’er the fleecy sieve. the Tawny Steer hath bellowed in the wooden vats.

Sanskit Text: सं धीतयो वावशाना अनूषत शिशुं रिहन्ति मतयः पनिप्नतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ dhītayo vāvaśānā anūṣata śiśuṃ rihanti matayaḥ panipnatam ||
Translation: Hymns have been sung aloud in resonant harmony, and holy songs kiss him, the Child who claims our praise.

Sanskit Text: स सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिः परि वयत तन्तुं तन्वानस्त्रिव्र्तंयथा विदे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ pari vyata tantuṃ tanvānastrivṛtaṃyathā vide |
Translation: 32 He hath assumed the rays of Sūrya for his robe, spinning, as he knows bow, the triply-twisted thread.

Sanskit Text: नयन्न्र्तस्य परशिषो नवीयसीः पतिर्जनीनामुप याति निष्क्र्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nayannṛtasya praśiṣo navīyasīḥ patirjanīnāmupa yāti niṣkṛtam ||
Translation: He, guiding to the newest rules of Holy Law, comes as the Women's Consort to the special place.

Sanskit Text: राजा सिन्धूनां पवते पतिर्दिव रतस्य याति पथिभिः कनिक्रदत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājā sindhūnāṃ pavate patirdiva ṛtasya yāti pathibhiḥ kanikradat |
Translation: 33 On flows the King of rivers and the Lord of heaven: he follows with a shout the paths of Holy Law.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रधारः परि षिच्यते हरिः पुनानो वाचं जनयन्नुपावसुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasradhāraḥ pari ṣicyate hariḥ punāno vācaṃ janayannupāvasuḥ ||
Translation: The Golden-hued is poured forth, with his hundred streams, Wealth-bringer, lifting up his voice while purified.

Sanskit Text: पवमान मह्यर्णो वि धावसि सूरो न चित्रो अव्ययानि पव्यया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamāna mahyarṇo vi dhāvasi sūro na citro avyayāni pavyayā |
Translation: 34 Fain to be cleansed, thou, Pavamana, pourest out, like wondrous Sūrya, through the fleece, an ample sea.

Sanskit Text: गभस्तिपूतो नर्भिरद्रिभिः सुतो महे वाजाय धन्याय धन्वसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghabhastipūto nṛbhiradribhiḥ suto mahe vājāya dhanyāya dhanvasi ||
Translation: Purified with the hands, pressed by the men with stones, thou speedest on to mighty booty-bringing war.

Sanskit Text: इषमूर्जं पवमानाभ्यर्षसि शयेनो न वंसु कलशेषुसीदसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣamūrjaṃ pavamānābhyarṣasi śyeno na vaṃsu kalaśeṣusīdasi |
Translation: 35 Thou, Pavamana, sendest food and power in streams. thou sittest in the beakers as a hawk on trees,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय मद्वा मद्यो मदः सुतो दिवो विष्टम्भ उपमो विचक्षणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya madvā madyo madaḥ suto divo viṣṭambha upamo vicakṣaṇaḥ ||
Translation: For Indra poured as cheering juice to make him glad, as nearest and farseeing bearer-up of heaven.

Sanskit Text: सप्त सवसारो अभि मातरः शिशुं नवं जज्ञानं जेन्यं विपश्चितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sapta svasāro abhi mātaraḥ śiśuṃ navaṃ jajñānaṃ jenyaṃ vipaścitam |
Translation: 36 The Sisters Seven, the Mothers, stand around the Babe, the noble, new-born Infant, skilled in holy song,

Sanskit Text: अपां गन्धर्वं दिव्यं नर्चक्षसं सोमंविश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāṃ ghandharvaṃ divyaṃ nṛcakṣasaṃ somaṃviśvasya bhuvanasya rājase ||
Translation: Gandharva of the floods, divine, beholding men, Soma, that he may reign as King of all the world.

Sanskit Text: ईशान इमा भुवनानि वीयसे युजान इन्दो हरितः सुपर्ण्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īśāna imā bhuvanāni vīyase yujāna indo haritaḥ suparṇyaḥ |
Translation: 37 As Sovran Lord thereof thou Passest through these worlds, O Indu, harnessing thy tawny well-winged Mares.

Sanskit Text: तास्ते कषरन्तु मधुमद घर्तं पयस्तव वरते सोम तिष्ठन्तु कर्ष्टयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāste kṣarantu madhumad ghṛtaṃ payastava vrate soma tiṣṭhantu kṛṣṭayaḥ ||
Translation: May they pour forth for thee milk and oil rich in sweets: O Soma, let the folk abide in thy decree.

Sanskit Text: तवं नर्चक्षा असि सोम विश्वतः पवमान वर्षभ ता वि धावसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ nṛcakṣā asi soma viśvataḥ pavamāna vṛṣabha tā vi dhāvasi |
Translation: 38 O Soma, thou beholdest men from every side: O Pavamana, Steer, thou wanderest through these.

Sanskit Text: स नः पवस्व वसुमद धिरण्यवद वयं सयाम भुवनेषु जीवसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ pavasva vasumad dhiraṇyavad vayaṃ syāma bhuvaneṣu jīvase ||
Translation: Pour out upon us wealth in treasure and in gold: may we have strength to live among the things that be.

Sanskit Text: गोवित पवस्व वसुविद धिरण्यविद रेतोधा इन्दो भुवनेष्वर्पितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghovit pavasva vasuvid dhiraṇyavid retodhā indo bhuvaneṣvarpitaḥ |
Translation: 39 Winner of gold and goods and cattle flow thou on, set as impregner, Indu, mid the worlds of life.

Sanskit Text: तवं सुवीरो असि सोम विश्ववित तं तवा विप्रा उप गिरेम आसते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ suvīro asi soma viśvavit taṃ tvā viprā upa ghirema āsate ||
Translation: Rich in brave men art thou, Soma, who winnest all: these holy singers wait upon thee with the song.

Sanskit Text: उन मध्व ऊर्मिर्वनना अतिष्ठिपदपो वसानो महिषो वि गाहते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: un madhva ūrmirvananā atiṣṭhipadapo vasāno mahiṣo vi ghāhate |
Translation: 40 The wave of flowing meath hath wakened up desires: the Steer enrobed in milk plunges into the streams.

Sanskit Text: राजा पवित्ररथो वाजमारुहत सहस्रभ्र्ष्टिर्जयति शरवो बर्हत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājā pavitraratho vājamāruhat sahasrabhṛṣṭirjayati śravo bṛhat ||
Translation: Borne on his chariot-sieve the King hath risen to war, and with a thousand rays hath won him high renown.

Sanskit Text: स भन्दना उदियर्ति परजावतीर्विश्वायुर्विश्वाः सुभरा अहर्दिवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa bhandanā udiyarti prajāvatīrviśvāyurviśvāḥ subharā ahardivi |
Translation: 41 Dear to all life, he sends triumphant praises forth, abundant, bringing offspring, each succeeding day.

Sanskit Text: बरह्म परजावद रयिमश्वपस्त्यं पीत इन्दविन्द्रमस्मभ्यं याचतात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahma prajāvad rayimaśvapastyaṃ pīta indavindramasmabhyaṃ yācatāt ||
Translation: From Indra crave for us, Indu, when thou art quaffed, the blessing that gives children, wealth that harbours steeds.

Sanskit Text: सो अग्रे अह्नां हरिर्हर्यतो मदः पर चेतसा चेतयते अनुद्युभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: so aghre ahnāṃ harirharyato madaḥ pra cetasā cetayate anudyubhiḥ |
Translation: 42 When days begin, the strong juice, lovely, golden-hued, is recognized by wisdom more and more each day,

Sanskit Text: दवा जना यातयन्नन्तरीयते नरा च शंसं दैव्यं च धर्तरि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvā janā yātayannantarīyate narā ca śaṃsaṃ daivyaṃ ca dhartari ||
Translation: He, stirring both the Races, goes between the two, the bearer of the word of men and word of Gods.

Sanskit Text: अञ्जते वयञ्जते समञ्जते करतुं रिहन्ति मधुनाभ्यञ्जते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: añjate vyañjate samañjate kratuṃ rihanti madhunābhyañjate |
Translation: 43 They balm him, balm him over balm him thoroughly, caress the mighty strength and balm it with the meath.

Sanskit Text: सिन्धोरुच्छ्वासे पतयन्तमुक्षणं हिरण्यपावाः पशुमासु गर्भ्णते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sindhorucchvāse patayantamukṣaṇaṃ hiraṇyapāvāḥ paśumāsu ghṛbhṇate ||
Translation: They seize the flying Steer at the stream's breathing-place: cleansing with gold they grasp the Animal herein.

Sanskit Text: विपश्चिते पवमानाय गायत मही न धारात्यन्धो अर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vipaścite pavamānāya ghāyata mahī na dhārātyandho arṣati |
Translation: 44 Sing forth to Pavamana skilled in holy song: the juice is flowing onward like a mighty stream.

Sanskit Text: अहिर्न जूर्णामति सर्पति तवचमत्यो न करीळन्नसरद वर्षा हरिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahirna jūrṇāmati sarpati tvacamatyo na krīḷannasarad vṛṣā hariḥ ||
Translation: He.glideth like a serpent from his ancient skin, and like a playful horse the Tawny Steer hath run.

Sanskit Text: अग्रेगो राजाप्यस्तविष्यते विमानो अह्नां भुवनेष्वर्पितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghregho rājāpyastaviṣyate vimāno ahnāṃ bhuvaneṣvarpitaḥ |
Translation: 45 Dweller in floods, King, foremost, he displays his might, set among living things as measurer of days.

Sanskit Text: हरिर्घ्र्तस्नुः सुद्र्शीको अर्णवो जयोतीरथः पवते राय ओक्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: harirghṛtasnuḥ sudṛśīko arṇavo jyotīrathaḥ pavate rāya okyaḥ ||
Translation: Distilling oil he flows, fair, billowy, golden-hued, borne on a car of light, sharing one hom-e with wealth.

Sanskit Text: असर्जि सकम्भो दिव उद्यतो मदः परि तरिधातुर्भुवनान्यर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asarji skambho diva udyato madaḥ pari tridhāturbhuvanānyarṣati |
Translation: 46 Loosed is the heavens! support, the uplifted cheering juice: the triply-mingled draught flows round into the worlds.

Sanskit Text: अंशुं रिहन्ति मतयः पनिप्नतं गिरा यदि निर्णिजं रग्मिणो ययुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṃśuṃ rihanti matayaḥ panipnataṃ ghirā yadi nirṇijaṃ ṛghmiṇo yayuḥ ||
Translation: The holy hymns caress the stalk that claims our praise, when singers have approached his beauteous robe with song.

Sanskit Text: पर ते धारा अत्यण्वानि मेष्यः पुनानस्य संयतो यन्तिरंहयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te dhārā atyaṇvāni meṣyaḥ punānasya saṃyato yantiraṃhayaḥ |
Translation: 47 Thy strearns that flow forth rapidly collected run over the fine fleece of the sheep as thou art cleansed.

Sanskit Text: यद गोभिरिन्दो चम्वोः समज्यस आ सुवानः सोम कलशेषु सीदसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad ghobhirindo camvoḥ samajyasa ā suvānaḥ soma kalaśeṣu sīdasi ||
Translation: When, Indu, thou art. balmed with milk within the bowl, thou sinkest in the jars, O Soma, when expressed.

Sanskit Text: पवस्व सोम करतुविन न उक्थ्यो.अव्यो वारे परि धाव मधु परियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva soma kratuvin na ukthyo.avyo vāre pari dhāva madhu priyam |
Translation: 48 Winner of power, flow, Soma, worthy of our laud: run onward to the fleece as well-beloved meath.

Sanskit Text: जहि विश्वान रक्षस इन्दो अत्रिणो बर्हद वदेम विदथेसुवीराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jahi viśvān rakṣasa indo atriṇo bṛhad vadema vidathesuvīrāḥ ||
Translation: Destroy, O Indu, all voracious Rākṣasas. With brave sons in the assembly let our speech be bold.

Sanskit Text: पर तु दरव परि कोशं नि षीद नर्भिः पुनानो अभि वाजमर्ष |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra tu drava pari kośaṃ ni ṣīda nṛbhiḥ punāno abhi vājamarṣa |
Translation: 1. RUN onward to the reservoir and seat thee: cleansed by the men speed forward to the battle.

Sanskit Text: अश्वं न तवा वाजिनं मर्जयन्तो.अछा बर्ही रशनाभिर्नयन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvaṃ na tvā vājinaṃ marjayanto.achā barhī raśanābhirnayanti ||
Translation: Making thee beauteous like an able courser, forth to the sacred grass with reins they lead thee.

Sanskit Text: सवायुधः पवते देव इन्दुरशस्तिहा वर्जनं रक्षमाणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāyudhaḥ pavate deva induraśastihā vṛjanaṃ rakṣamāṇaḥ |
Translation: 2 Indu, the well-armed God, is flowing onward, who quells the curse and guards from treacherous onslaught,

Sanskit Text: पिता देवानां जनिता सुदक्षो विष्टम्भो दिवो धरुणः पर्थिव्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pitā devānāṃ janitā sudakṣo viṣṭambho divo dharuṇaḥ pṛthivyāḥ ||
Translation: Father, begetter of the Gods, most skilful, the buttress of the heavens and earth's supporter.

Sanskit Text: रषिर्विप्रः पुरेता जनानां रभुर्धीर उशना काव्येन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṣirvipraḥ puraetā janānāṃ ṛbhurdhīra uśanā kāvyena |
Translation: 3. Ṛṣi and Sage, the Champion of the people, cleft and sagacious, Uśanā in wisdom,

Sanskit Text: स चिद विवेद निहितं यदासामपीच्यं गुह्यं नाम गोनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa cid viveda nihitaṃ yadāsāmapīcyaṃ ghuhyaṃ nāma ghonām ||
Translation: He hath discovered even their hidden nature, the Cows' concealed and most mysterious title.

Sanskit Text: एष सय ते मधुमानिन्द्र सोमो वर्षा वर्ष्णे परि पवित्रे अक्षाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa sya te madhumānindra somo vṛṣā vṛṣṇe pari pavitre akṣāḥ |
Translation: 4 This thine own Soma rich in meath, O Indra, Steer for the Steer, hath flowed into the filter.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रसाः शतसा भूरिदावा शश्वत्तमं बर्हिरा वाज्यस्थात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasrasāḥ śatasā bhūridāvā śaśvattamaṃ barhirā vājyasthāt ||
Translation: The strong Free-giver, winning hundreds, thousands, hath reached the holy grass that never fails him.

Sanskit Text: एते सोमा अभि गव्या सहस्रा महे वाजायाम्र्ताय शरवांसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete somā abhi ghavyā sahasrā mahe vājāyāmṛtāya śravāṃsi |
Translation: 5 These Somas are for wealth of countless cattle, renown therefor, and mighty strength immortal.

Sanskit Text: पवित्रेभिः पवमाना अस्र्ग्रञ्छ्रवस्यवो न पर्तनाजो अत्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavitrebhiḥ pavamānā asṛghrañchravasyavo na pṛtanājo atyāḥ ||
Translation: These have been sent forth, urified by strainers, like steeds who rusg to battle fain for glory.

Sanskit Text: परि हि षमा पुरुहूतो जनानां विश्वासरद भोजना पूयमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari hi ṣmā puruhūto janānāṃ viśvāsarad bhojanā pūyamānaḥ |
Translation: 6 He, while he cleanses him, invoked of many, hath flowed to give the people all enjoyment.

Sanskit Text: अथा भर शयेनभ्र्त परयांसि रयिं तुञ्जानो अभि वाजमर्ष ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā bhara śyenabhṛta prayāṃsi rayiṃ tuñjāno abhi vājamarṣa ||
Translation: Thou whom the Falcon brought, bring, dainty viands, bestir thyself and send us wealth and booty.

Sanskit Text: एष सुवानः परि सोमः पवित्रे सर्गो न सर्ष्टो अदधावदर्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa suvānaḥ pari somaḥ pavitre sargho na sṛṣṭo adadhāvadarvā |
Translation: 7 This Soma, pressed into the cleansing filter, hath run as ’twere a host let loose, the Courser;

Sanskit Text: तिग्मे शिशानो महिषो न शर्ङगे गा गव्यन्नभिशूरो न सत्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tighme śiśāno mahiṣo na śṛṅghe ghā ghavyannabhiśūro na satvā ||
Translation: Like a strong bull who whets his horns kpen-pointed, like a brave warrior in the fray for cattle.

Sanskit Text: एषा ययौ परमादन्तरद्रेः कूचित सतीरूर्वे गा विवेद |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣā yayau paramādantaradreḥ kūcit satīrūrve ghā viveda |
Translation: 8 He issued forth from out the loftiest mountain, and found kine hidden somewhere in a stable.

Sanskit Text: दिवो न विद्युत सतनयन्त्यभ्रैः सोमस्य ते पवत इन्द्रधारा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo na vidyut stanayantyabhraiḥ somasya te pavata indradhārā ||
Translation: Soma's stream clears itself for thee, O Indra, like lightning thundering through the clouds of heaven,

Sanskit Text: उत सम राशिं परि यासि गोनामिन्द्रेण सोम सरथं पुनानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta sma rāśiṃ pari yāsi ghonāmindreṇa soma sarathaṃ punānaḥ |
Translation: 9 Cleansing thyselr, and borne along with Indra, Soma, thou goest round the herd of cattle.

Sanskit Text: पूर्वीरिषो बर्हतीर्जीरदानो शिक्षा शचीवस्तव ता उपष्टुत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvīriṣo bṛhatīrjīradāno śikṣā śacīvastava tā upaṣṭut ||
Translation: May thy praise help us, Mighty One, prompt Giver, to the full ample food which thou bestowest.

Sanskit Text: परो सय वह्निः पथ्याभिरस्यान दिवो न वर्ष्टिः पवमानोक्षाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pro sya vahniḥ pathyābhirasyān divo na vṛṣṭiḥ pavamānoakṣāḥ |
Translation: 1. THIS Chariot-horse hath moved along the pathways, and Pavamana flowed like rain from heaven.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रधारो असदन नयस्मे मातुरुपस्थे वन आच सोमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasradhāro asadan nyasme māturupasthe vana āca somaḥ ||
Translation: With us hath Soma with a thousand currents sunk in the wood, upon his Mother's bosom.

Sanskit Text: राजा सिन्धूनामवसिष्ट वास रतस्य नावमारुहद रजिष्ठाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājā sindhūnāmavasiṣṭa vāsa ṛtasya nāvamāruhad rajiṣṭhām |
Translation: 2. King, he hath clothed him in the robe of rivers, mounted the straightest-going ship of Order.

Sanskit Text: अप्सु दरप्सो वाव्र्धे शयेनजूतो दुह ईं पिता दुह ईं पितुर्जाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apsu drapso vāvṛdhe śyenajūto duha īṃ pitā duha īṃ piturjām ||
Translation: Sped by the Hawk the drop hath waxed in waters: the father drains it, drains the Father's offspring.

Sanskit Text: सिंहं नसन्त मध्वो अयासं हरिमरुषं दिवो अस्य पतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: siṃhaṃ nasanta madhvo ayāsaṃ harimaruṣaṃ divo asya patim |
Translation: 3 They come to him, red, tawny, Lord of Heaven, the watchful Guardian of the meath, the Lion.

Sanskit Text: शूरो युत्सु परथमः पर्छते गा अस्य चक्षसा परि पात्युक्षा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śūro yutsu prathamaḥ pṛchate ghā asya cakṣasā pari pātyukṣā ||
Translation: First, Hero in the fight, he seeks the cattle, and with his eye the Steer is our protector.

Sanskit Text: मधुप्र्ष्ठं घोरमयासमश्वं रथे युञ्जन्त्युरुचक्रर्ष्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhupṛṣṭhaṃ ghoramayāsamaśvaṃ rathe yuñjantyurucakraṛṣvam |
Translation: 4 They harness to the broad-wheeled car the mighty Courser whose back bears meath, unwearied, awful.

Sanskit Text: सवसार ईं जामयो मर्जयन्ति सनाभयो वाजिनमूर्जयन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svasāra īṃ jāmayo marjayanti sanābhayo vājinamūrjayanti ||
Translation: The twins, the sisters brighten him, and strengthen-these children of one damethe vigorous Racer.

Sanskit Text: चतस्र ईं घर्तदुहः सचन्ते समाने अन्तर्धरुणे निषत्ताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: catasra īṃ ghṛtaduhaḥ sacante samāne antardharuṇe niṣattāḥ |
Translation: 5 Four pouring out the holy oil attend him, sitting together in the same container.

Sanskit Text: ता ईमर्षन्ति नमसा पुनानास्ता ईं विश्वतः परि षन्ति पूर्वीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā īmarṣanti namasā punānāstā īṃ viśvataḥ pari ṣanti pūrvīḥ ||
Translation: To him they flow, when purified, with homage, and still, from every side, are first about him.

Sanskit Text: विष्टम्भो दिवो धरुणः पर्थिव्या विश्वा उत कषितयो हस्ते अस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viṣṭambho divo dharuṇaḥ pṛthivyā viśvā uta kṣitayo haste asya |
Translation: 6 He is the buttress of the heavens, supporter of earth, and in his hand are all the people.

Sanskit Text: असत त उत्सो गर्णते नियुत्वान मध्वो अंशुः पवतैन्द्रियाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asat ta utso ghṛṇate niyutvān madhvo aṃśuḥ pavataindriyāya ||
Translation: Be the team's Lord a well to thee the singer: cleansed is the sweet plant's stalk for deed of glory.

Sanskit Text: वन्वन्नवातो अभि देववीतिमिन्द्राय सोम वर्त्रहा पवस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanvannavāto abhi devavītimindrāya soma vṛtrahā pavasva |
Translation: 7 Fighting, uninjured come where Gods are feasted; Soma, as Vitra-slayer flow for Indra.

Sanskit Text: शग्धि महः पुरुश्चन्द्रस्य रायः सुवीर्यस्य पतयः सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaghdhi mahaḥ puruścandrasya rāyaḥ suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma ||
Translation: Vouchsafe us ample riches very splendid may we be masters of heroic vigour.

Sanskit Text: पर हिन्वानो जनिता रोदस्यो रथो न वाजं सनिष्यन्नयासीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra hinvāno janitā rodasyo ratho na vājaṃ saniṣyannayāsīt |
Translation: 1. URGED On, the Father of the Earth and Heaven hath gone forth like a car to gather booty,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं गछन्नायुधा संशिशानो विश्वा वसु हस्तयोरादधानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ ghachannāyudhā saṃśiśāno viśvā vasu hastayorādadhānaḥ ||
Translation: Going to Indra, sharpening his weapons, and in his hand containing every treasure.

Sanskit Text: अभि तरिप्र्ष्ठं वर्षणं वयोधामाङगूषाणामवावशन्त वाणीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tripṛṣṭhaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vayodhāmāṅghūṣāṇāmavāvaśanta vāṇīḥ |
Translation: 2 To him the tones of sacred song have sounded, Steer of the triple height, the Life-bestower.

Sanskit Text: वना वसानो वरुणो न सिन्धून वि रत्नधा दयते वार्याणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanā vasāno varuṇo na sindhūn vi ratnadhā dayate vāryāṇi ||
Translation: Dwelling in wood as Varuṇa in rivers, lavishing treasure he distributes blessings

Sanskit Text: शूरग्रामः सर्ववीरः सहावाञ जेता पवस्व सनिता धनानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śūraghrāmaḥ sarvavīraḥ sahāvāñ jetā pavasva sanitā dhanāni |
Translation: 3 Great Conqueror, warnor-girt, Lord of all heroes, flow on thy way as he who winneth riches;

Sanskit Text: तिग्मायुधः कषिप्रधन्वा समत्स्वषाळ्हः साह्वान्प्र्तनासु शत्रून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tighmāyudhaḥ kṣipradhanvā samatsvaṣāḷhaḥ sāhvānpṛtanāsu śatrūn ||
Translation: With sharpened. arms, with swift bow, never vanquished in battle, vanquishing in fight the foemen.

Sanskit Text: उरुगव्यूतिरभयानि कर्ण्वन समीचीने आ पवस्वा पुरन्धी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: urughavyūtirabhayāni kṛṇvan samīcīne ā pavasvā purandhī |
Translation: 4 Giving security, Lord of wide dominion, send us both earth and heaven with all their fulness.

Sanskit Text: अपः सिषासन्नुषसः सवर्गाः सं चिक्रदो महो अस्मभ्यं वाजान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apaḥ siṣāsannuṣasaḥ svarghāḥ saṃ cikrado maho asmabhyaṃ vājān ||
Translation: Striving to win the Dawns, the light, the waters, and cattle, call to us abundant vigour.

Sanskit Text: मत्सि सोम वरुणं मत्सि मित्रं मत्सीन्द्रमिन्दो पवमान विष्णुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: matsi soma varuṇaṃ matsi mitraṃ matsīndramindo pavamāna viṣṇum |
Translation: 5 O Soma, gladden Varuṇa and Mitra; cheer, Indu Pavamana! Indra, Viṣṇu.

Sanskit Text: मत्सि शर्धो मारुतं मत्सि देवान मत्सि महामिन्द्रमिन्दो मदाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: matsi śardho mārutaṃ matsi devān matsi mahāmindramindo madāya ||
Translation: Cheer thou the Gods, the Company of Maruts: Indu, cheer mighty Indra to rejoicing.

Sanskit Text: एवा राजेव करतुमानमेन विश्वा घनिघ्नद दुरिता पवस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā rājeva kratumānamena viśvā ghanighnad duritā pavasva |
Translation: 6 Thus like a wise and potent King flow onward, destroying with thy vigour all misfortunes.

Sanskit Text: इन्दो सूक्ताय वचसे वयो धा यूयं पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indo sūktāya vacase vayo dhā yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ ||
Translation: For our well-spoken hymn give life, O Indu. Do ye preserve us evermore with blessings.

Sanskit Text: असर्जि वक्वा रथ्ये यथाजौ धिया मनोता परथमो मनीषी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asarji vakvā rathye yathājau dhiyā manotā prathamo manīṣī |
Translation: 1. As for a chariot-race, the skilful Speaker, Chief, Sage, Inventor, hath, with song, been started.

Sanskit Text: दश सवसारो अधि सानो अव्ये.अजन्ति वह्निं सदनान्यछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśa svasāro adhi sāno avye.ajanti vahniṃ sadanānyacha ||
Translation: The sisters ten upon the fleecy summit drive on the Car-horse to the resting places.

Sanskit Text: वीती जनस्य दिव्यस्य कव्यैरधि सुवानो नहुष्येभिरिन्दुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vītī janasya divyasya kavyairadhi suvāno nahuṣyebhirinduḥ |
Translation: 2 The drop of Soma, pressed by wise Nahusyas, becomes the banquet of the Heavenly People-

Sanskit Text: पर यो नर्भिरम्र्तो मर्त्येभिर्मर्म्र्जानो.अविभिर्गोभिरद्भिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yo nṛbhiramṛto martyebhirmarmṛjāno.avibhirghobhiradbhiḥ ||
Translation: Indu, by hands of mortal men made beauteous, immortal, with the sheep and cows and waters.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा वर्ष्ने रोरुवदंशुरस्मै पवमानो रुशदीर्ते पयोगोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā vṛṣne roruvadaṃśurasmai pavamāno ruśadīrte payoghoḥ |
Translation: 3 Steer roaring unto Steer, this Pavamana, this juice runs to the white milk of the milch-cow.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रं रक्वा पथिभिर्वचोविदध्वस्मभिः सूरो अण्वं वि याति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasraṃ ṛkvā pathibhirvacovidadhvasmabhiḥ sūro aṇvaṃ vi yāti ||
Translation: Through thousand fine hairs goes the tuneful Singer, like Sūra by his fair and open pathways.

Sanskit Text: रुजा दर्ळ्हा चिद रक्षसः सदांसि पुनान इन्द ऊर्णुहि विवाजान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rujā dṛḷhā cid rakṣasaḥ sadāṃsi punāna inda ūrṇuhi vivājān |
Translation: 4 Break down the, strong seats even of the demons: cleansing thee, Indu, robd thyself in vigour.

Sanskit Text: वर्श्चोपरिष्टात तुजता वधेन ये अन्ति दूरादुपनायमेषाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛścopariṣṭāt tujatā vadhena ye anti dūrādupanāyameṣām ||
Translation: Rend with thy swift bolt, coming from above them, those who are near and those who yet are distant.

Sanskit Text: स परत्नवन नव्यसे विश्ववार सूक्ताय पथः कर्णुहि पराचः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pratnavan navyase viśvavāra sūktāya pathaḥ kṛṇuhi prācaḥ |
Translation: 5 Prepare the forward paths in ancient manner for the new bymn, thou Giver of all bounties.

Sanskit Text: ये दुःषहासो वनुषा बर्हन्तस्तांस्ते अश्याम पुरुक्र्त पुरुक्षो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye duḥṣahāso vanuṣā bṛhantastāṃste aśyāma purukṛt purukṣo ||
