Translation: Those which are high and hard for foes to conquer may we gain from thee, Active! Food-bestower!

Sanskit Text: एवा पुनानो अपः सवर्गा अस्मभ्यं तोका तनयानि भूरि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā punāno apaḥ svarghā asmabhyaṃ tokā tanayāni bhūri |
Translation: 6 So purifying thee vouchsafe us waters, heaven's light, and cows, offipring and many children.

Sanskit Text: शं नः कषेत्रमुरु जयोतींषि सोम जयों नः सूर्यन्द्र्शये रिरीहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ naḥ kṣetramuru jyotīṃṣi soma jyoṃ naḥ sūryandṛśaye rirīhi ||
Translation: Give us health, ample land, and lights, O Soma, and grant us long to look upon the sunshine.

Sanskit Text: परि सुवानो हरिरंशुः पवित्रे रथो न सर्जि सनये हियानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari suvāno hariraṃśuḥ pavitre ratho na sarji sanaye hiyānaḥ |
Translation: 1. THE gold-hued juice, poured out upon the filter, is started like a car sent forth to conquer.

Sanskit Text: आपच्छ्लोकमिन्द्रियं पूयमानः परति देवानजुषत परयोभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpacchlokamindriyaṃ pūyamānaḥ prati devānajuṣata prayobhiḥ ||
Translation: He hath gained song and vigour while they cleansed him, and hath rejoiced the Gods with entertainments.

Sanskit Text: अछा नर्चक्षा असरत पवित्रे नाम दधानः कविरस्य योनौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: achā nṛcakṣā asarat pavitre nāma dadhānaḥ kavirasya yonau |
Translation: 2 He who beholdeth man hath reached the filter: bearing his name, the Sage hath sought his dwelling.

Sanskit Text: सीदन होतेव सदने चमूषूपेमग्मन्न्र्षयः सप्त विप्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sīdan hoteva sadane camūṣūpemaghmannṛṣayaḥ sapta viprāḥ ||
Translation: The Ṛṣis came to him, seven holy singers, when in the bowls he settled as Invoker.

Sanskit Text: पर सुमेधा गातुविद विश्वदेवः सोमः पुनानः सद एति नित्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sumedhā ghātuvid viśvadevaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ sada eti nityam |
Translation: 3 Shared by all Gods, mobt wise, propitious, Soma goes, while they cleanse him, to his constant station.

Sanskit Text: भुवद विश्वेषु काव्येषु रन्तानु जनान यतते पञ्च धीरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhuvad viśveṣu kāvyeṣu rantānu janān yatate pañca dhīraḥ ||
Translation: Let him rejoice in all his lofty wisdom to the Five Tribes the Sage attains with labour.

Sanskit Text: तव तये सोम पवमान निण्ये विश्वे देवास्त्रय एकादशासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava tye soma pavamāna niṇye viśve devāstraya ekādaśāsaḥ |
Translation: 4 In thy mysterious place, O Pavamana Soma, are all the Gods, the Thrice-Eleven.

Sanskit Text: दश सवधाभिरधि सानो अव्ये मर्जन्ति तवा नद्यः सप्त यह्वीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśa svadhābhiradhi sāno avye mṛjanti tvā nadyaḥ sapta yahvīḥ ||
Translation: Ten on the fleecy height, themselves, self-prompted, and seven fresh rivers, brighten and adorn thee.

Sanskit Text: तन नु सत्यं पवमानस्यास्तु यत्र विश्वे कारवः संनसन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan nu satyaṃ pavamānasyāstu yatra viśve kāravaḥ saṃnasanta |
Translation: 5 Now let this be the truth of Pavamana, there where all singers gather them together,

Sanskit Text: जयोतिर्यदह्ने अक्र्णोदु लोकं परावन मनुं दस्यवे करभीकम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyotiryadahne akṛṇodu lokaṃ prāvan manuṃ dasyave karabhīkam ||
Translation: That he hath given us room and made the daylight, hath holpen Manu and repelled the Dasyu.

Sanskit Text: परि सद्मेव पशुमान्ति होता राजा न सत्यः समितीरियानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari sadmeva paśumānti hotā rājā na satyaḥ samitīriyānaḥ |
Translation: 6 As the priest seeks the station rich in cattle, like a true King who goes to great assemblies,

Sanskit Text: सोमः पुनानः कलशानयासीत सीदन मर्गो न महिषो वनेषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśānayāsīt sīdan mṛgho na mahiṣo vaneṣu ||
Translation: Soma hath sought the beakers while they cleansed him, and like a wild bull, in the wood hath settled.

Sanskit Text: साकमुक्षो मर्जयन्त सवसारो दश धीरस्य धीतयो धनुत्रीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sākamukṣo marjayanta svasāro daśa dhīrasya dhītayo dhanutrīḥ |
Translation: 1. TEN sisters, pouring out the rain together, swift-moving thinkers of the sage, adorn him.

Sanskit Text: हरिः पर्यद्रवज्जाः सूर्यस्य दरोणं ननक्षे अत्यो न वाजी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hariḥ paryadravajjāḥ sūryasya droṇaṃ nanakṣe atyo na vājī ||
Translation: Hither hath run the gold-hued Child of Sūrya and reached the vat like a fleet vigorous courser.

Sanskit Text: सं मात्र्भिर्न शिशुर्वावशानो वर्षा दधन्वे पुरुवारोद्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ mātṛbhirna śiśurvāvaśāno vṛṣā dadhanve puruvāroadbhiḥ |
Translation: 2 Even as a youngling crying to his mothers, the bounteous Steer hath flowed along to waters.

Sanskit Text: मर्यो न योषामभि निष्क्र्तं यन सं गछते कलश उस्रियाभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maryo na yoṣāmabhi niṣkṛtaṃ yan saṃ ghachate kalaśa usriyābhiḥ ||
Translation: As youth to damsel, so with milk he hastens on to the. chose meeting-place, the beaker.

Sanskit Text: उत पर पिप्य ऊधरघ्न्याया इन्दुर्धाराभिः सचते सुमेधाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta pra pipya ūdharaghnyāyā indurdhārābhiḥ sacate sumedhāḥ |
Translation: 3 Yea, swollen is the udder of the milch-cow: thither in streams goes very sapient Indu.

Sanskit Text: मूर्धानं गावः पयसा चमूष्वभि शरीणन्ति वसुभिर्न निक्तैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mūrdhānaṃ ghāvaḥ payasā camūṣvabhi śrīṇanti vasubhirna niktaiḥ ||
Translation: The kine make ready, as with new-washed treasures, the Head and Chief with milk within the vessels.

Sanskit Text: स नो देवेभिः पवमान रदेन्दो रयिमश्विनं वावशानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no devebhiḥ pavamāna radendo rayimaśvinaṃ vāvaśānaḥ |
Translation: 4 With all the Gods, O Indu Pavamana, while thou art roaring send us wealth in horses.

Sanskit Text: रथिरायतामुशती पुरन्धिरस्मद्र्यगा दावने वसूनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathirāyatāmuśatī purandhirasmadryaghā dāvane vasūnām ||
Translation: Hither upon her car come willing Plenty, inclined to us, to give us of her treasures.

Sanskit Text: नू नो रयिमुप मास्व नर्वन्तं पुनानो वाताप्यं विश्वश्चन्द्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū no rayimupa māsva nṛvantaṃ punāno vātāpyaṃ viśvaścandram |
Translation: 5 Now unto us mete riches, while they cleansethee, all-glorious, swelling wealth, with store of heroes.

Sanskit Text: पर वन्दितुरिन्दो तार्यायुः परातर्मक्षू धियावसुर्जगम्यात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vanditurindo tāryāyuḥ prātarmakṣū dhiyāvasurjaghamyāt ||
Translation: Long be his life who worships, thee, O Indu. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

Sanskit Text: अधि यदस्मिन वाजिनीव शुभ सपर्धन्ते धियः सूर्ये नविशः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi yadasmin vājinīva śubha spardhante dhiyaḥ sūrye naviśaḥ |
Translation: 1. WHEN beauties strive for him as for a charger, then strive the songs like soldiers for the sunlight.

Sanskit Text: अपो वर्णानः पवते कवीयन वरजं न पशुवर्धनाय मन्म ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apo vṛṇānaḥ pavate kavīyan vrajaṃ na paśuvardhanāya manma ||
Translation: Acting the Sage, he flows enrobed in waters and song as ’twere a stall that kine may prosper.

Sanskit Text: दविता वयूर्ण्वन्नम्र्तस्य धाम सवर्विदे भुवनानि परथन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvitā vyūrṇvannamṛtasya dhāma svarvide bhuvanāni prathanta |
Translation: 2 The worlds expand to hirn who from aforetime found light to spread the law of life eternal.

Sanskit Text: धियः पिन्वानाः सवसरे न गाव रतायन्तीरभि वावश्र इन्दुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiyaḥ pinvānāḥ svasare na ghāva ṛtāyantīrabhi vāvaśra indum ||
Translation: The swelling songs, like kine within the stable, in deep devotion call aloud on Indu.

Sanskit Text: परि यत कविः काव्या भरते शूरो न रथो भुवनानि विश्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari yat kaviḥ kāvyā bharate śūro na ratho bhuvanāni viśvā |
Translation: 3 When the sage bears his holy wisdom round him, like a car visiting all worlds, the Hero,

Sanskit Text: देवेषु यशो मर्ताय भूषन दक्षाय रायः पुरुभूषु नव्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: deveṣu yaśo martāya bhūṣan dakṣāya rāyaḥ purubhūṣu navyaḥ ||
Translation: Becoming fame, mid Gods, unto the mortal, wealth to the skilled, worth praise mid the Ever-present,

Sanskit Text: शरिये जातः शरिय आ निरियाय शरियं वयो जरित्र्भ्यो दधाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śriye jātaḥ śriya ā niriyāya śriyaṃ vayo jaritṛbhyo dadhāti |
Translation: 4 For glory born be hath come forth to glory: he giveth life and glory to the singers.

Sanskit Text: शरियं वसाना अम्र्तत्वमायन भवन्ति सत्या समिथा मितद्रौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śriyaṃ vasānā amṛtatvamāyan bhavanti satyā samithā mitadrau ||
Translation: They, clothed in glory, have become immortal. He, measured in his course, makes frays successful.

Sanskit Text: इषमूर्जमभ्यर्षाश्वं गामुरु जयोतिः कर्णुहि मत्सि देवान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣamūrjamabhyarṣāśvaṃ ghāmuru jyotiḥ kṛṇuhi matsi devān |
Translation: 5 Stream to us food and vigour, kine and horses: give us broad lights and fill thGods with rapture.

Sanskit Text: विश्वानि हि सुषहा तानि तुभ्यं पवमान बाधसेसोम शत्रून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāni hi suṣahā tāni tubhyaṃ pavamāna bādhasesoma śatrūn ||
Translation: All ther are easy things for thee to master thou, Pavamana Soma, quellest foemen.

Sanskit Text: कनिक्रन्ति हरिरा सर्ज्यमानः सीदन वनस्य जठरे पुनानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kanikranti harirā sṛjyamānaḥ sīdan vanasya jaṭhare punānaḥ |
Translation: 1. Loud neighs the Tawny Steed when started, settling deep in the wooden vessel while they cleanse him.

Sanskit Text: नर्भिर्यतः कर्णुते निर्णिजं गा अतो मतीर्जनयतस्वधाभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛbhiryataḥ kṛṇute nirṇijaṃ ghā ato matīrjanayatasvadhābhiḥ ||
Translation: Led by the men he takes the milk for raiment: then shall he, through his powers, engender praise-songs.

Sanskit Text: हरिः सर्जानः पथ्यां रतस्येयर्ति वाचमरितेव नावम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hariḥ sṛjānaḥ pathyāṃ ṛtasyeyarti vācamariteva nāvam |
Translation: 2 As one who rows drives on his boat, he, Gold-hued, sends forth his voice, loosed on the path of Order.

Sanskit Text: देवो देवानां गुह्यानि नामाविष कर्णोति बर्हिषि परवाचे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devo devānāṃ ghuhyāni nāmāviṣ kṛṇoti barhiṣi pravāce ||
Translation: As God, the secret names of Gods he utters, to be declared on sacred grass more widely.

Sanskit Text: अपामिवेदूर्मयस्तर्तुराणाः पर मनीषा ईरते सोममछ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāmivedūrmayastarturāṇāḥ pra manīṣā īrate somamacha |
Translation: 3 Hastening onward like the waves of waters, our holy hymns are pressing nigh to Soma.

Sanskit Text: नमस्यन्तीरुप च यन्ति सं चा च विशन्त्युशतीरुशन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: namasyantīrupa ca yanti saṃ cā ca viśantyuśatīruśantam ||
Translation: To him they come with lowly adoration, and, longing, enter him who longs to meet them.

Sanskit Text: तं मर्म्र्जानं महिषं न सानावंशुं दुहन्त्युक्षणं गिरिष्ठाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ marmṛjānaṃ mahiṣaṃ na sānāvaṃśuṃ duhantyukṣaṇaṃ ghiriṣṭhām |
Translation: 4 They drain the stalk, the Steer who dwells on mountains, even as a Bull who decks him on the upland.

Sanskit Text: तं वावशानं मतयः सचन्ते तरितो बिभर्ति वरुणं समुद्रे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vāvaśānaṃ matayaḥ sacante trito bibharti varuṇaṃ samudre ||
Translation: Hymns follow and attend him as he bellows: Trita bears Varuṇa aloft in ocean.

Sanskit Text: इष्यन वाचमुपवक्तेव होतुः पुनान इन्दो वि षया मनीषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣyan vācamupavakteva hotuḥ punāna indo vi ṣyā manīṣām |
Translation: 5 Sending thy voice out as Director, loosen the Invoker's thought, O Indu, as they cleanse thee.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रश्च यत कषयथः सौभगाय सुवीर्यस्य पतयःस्याम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraśca yat kṣayathaḥ saubhaghāya suvīryasya patayaḥsyāma ||
Translation: While thou and Indra rule for our advantage, may we be masters of heroic vigour.

Sanskit Text: पर सेनानीः शूरो अग्रे रथानां गव्यन्नेति हर्षते अस्य सेना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra senānīḥ śūro aghre rathānāṃ ghavyanneti harṣate asya senā |
Translation: 1. IN forefront of the cars forth goes the Hero, the Leader, winning spoil: his host rejoices.

Sanskit Text: भद्रान कर्ण्वन्निन्द्रहवान सखिभ्य आ सोमो वस्त्रा रभसानि दत्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadrān kṛṇvannindrahavān sakhibhya ā somo vastrā rabhasāni datte ||
Translation: Soma endues his robes of lasting colours, and blesses, for his friends, their calls on Indra.

Sanskit Text: समस्य हरिं हरयो मर्जन्त्यश्वहयैरनिशितं नमोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samasya hariṃ harayo mṛjantyaśvahayairaniśitaṃ namobhiḥ |
Translation: 2 Men decked with gold adorn his golden tendril, incessantly with steed-impelling homage.

Sanskit Text: आ तिष्ठति रथमिन्द्रस्य सखा विद्वानेना सुमतिं यात्यछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tiṣṭhati rathamindrasya sakhā vidvānenā sumatiṃ yātyacha ||
Translation: The Friend of Indra mounts his car well-knowing, he comes thereon to meet the prayer we offer.

Sanskit Text: स नो देव देवताते पवस्व महे सोम पसरस इन्द्रपानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no deva devatāte pavasva mahe soma psarasa indrapānaḥ |
Translation: 3 O God, for service of the Gods flow onward, for food sublime, as Indra's drink, O Soma.

Sanskit Text: कर्ण्वन्नपो वर्षयन दयामुतेमामुरोरा नो वरिवस्या पुनानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṇvannapo varṣayan dyāmutemāmurorā no varivasyā punānaḥ ||
Translation: Making the floods, bedewing earth and heaven, come from the vast, comfort us while we cleanse thee

Sanskit Text: अजीतये.अहतये पवस्व सवस्तये सर्वतातये बर्हते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajītaye.ahataye pavasva svastaye sarvatātaye bṛhate |
Translation: 4 Flow for prosperity and constant Vigour, flow on for happiness and high perfection.

Sanskit Text: तदुशन्ति विश्व इमे सखायस्तदहं वश्मि पवमान सोम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taduśanti viśva ime sakhāyastadahaṃ vaśmi pavamāna soma ||
Translation: This is the wish of these friends assembled: this is my wish, O Soma Pavamana.

Sanskit Text: सोमः पवते जनिता मतीनां जनिता दिवो जनिता पर्थिव्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaḥ pavate janitā matīnāṃ janitā divo janitā pṛthivyāḥ |
Translation: 5 Father of holy hymns, Soma flows onward the Father of the earth, Father of heaven:

Sanskit Text: जनिताग्नेर्जनिता सूर्यस्य जनितेन्द्रस्य जनितोत विष्णोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: janitāghnerjanitā sūryasya janitendrasya janitota viṣṇoḥ ||
Translation: Father of Agni, Sūrya's generator, the Father who begat Indra and Viṣṇu.

Sanskit Text: बरह्मा देवानां पदवीः कवीनां रषिर्विप्राणां महिषोम्र्गाणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmā devānāṃ padavīḥ kavīnāṃ ṛṣirviprāṇāṃ mahiṣomṛghāṇām |
Translation: 6 Brahman of Gods, the Leader of the poets, Ṛṣi of sages, Bull of savage creatures,

Sanskit Text: शयेनो गर्ध्राणां सवधितिर्वनानां सोमः पवित्रमत्येति रेभन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śyeno ghṛdhrāṇāṃ svadhitirvanānāṃ somaḥ pavitramatyeti rebhan ||
Translation: Falcon amid the vultures, Axe of forests, over the cleansing sieve goes Soma singing.

Sanskit Text: परावीविपद वाच ऊर्मिं न सिन्धुर्गिरः सोमः पवमानोमनीषाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāvīvipad vāca ūrmiṃ na sindhurghiraḥ somaḥ pavamānomanīṣāḥ |
Translation: 7 He, Soma Pavamana, like a river, hath stirred the wave of voice, our songs and praises.

Sanskit Text: अन्तः पश्यन वर्जनेमावराण्या तिष्ठति वर्षभो गोषु जानन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: antaḥ paśyan vṛjanemāvarāṇyā tiṣṭhati vṛṣabho ghoṣu jānan ||
Translation: Beholding these inferior powers in cattle, he rests among them as a Steer well-knowing.

Sanskit Text: स मत्सरः पर्त्सु वन्वन्नवातः सहस्ररेता अभि वाजमर्ष |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa matsaraḥ pṛtsu vanvannavātaḥ sahasraretā abhi vājamarṣa |
Translation: 8 As Gladdener, Warrior never harmed in battle, with thousand genial streams, pour strength and vigour.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रायेन्दो पवमानो मनीष्यंशोरूर्मिमीरय गा इषण्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāyendo pavamāno manīṣyaṃśorūrmimīraya ghā iṣaṇyan ||
Translation: As thoughtful Pavamana, urge O Indu, speeding the kine, the plant's wave on to Indra.

Sanskit Text: परि परियः कलशे देववात इन्द्राय सोमो रण्यो मदाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari priyaḥ kalaśe devavāta indrāya somo raṇyo madāya |
Translation: 9 Dear, grateful to the Gods, on to the beaker moves Soma, sweet to Indra, to delight him.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रधारः शतवाज इन्दुर्वाजी न सप्तिः समना जिगाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasradhāraḥ śatavāja indurvājī na saptiḥ samanā jighāti ||
Translation: With hundred powers, with thousand currents, Indu, like a strong car-horse, goes to the assembly.

Sanskit Text: स पूर्व्यो वसुविज्जायमानो मर्जानो अप्सु दुदुहानो अद्रौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pūrvyo vasuvijjāyamāno mṛjāno apsu duduhāno adrau |
Translation: 10 Born in old time as finder-out of treasures, drained with the stone, decking himself in waters,

Sanskit Text: अभिशस्तिपा भुवनस्य राजा विदद गातुं बरह्मणे पूयमानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhiśastipā bhuvanasya rājā vidad ghātuṃ brahmaṇe pūyamānaḥ ||
Translation: Warding off curses, King of all existence, he shall find way for prayer the while they cleanse him.

Sanskit Text: तवया हि नः पितरः सोम पूर्वे कर्माणि चक्रुः पवमानधीराः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā hi naḥ pitaraḥ soma pūrve karmāṇi cakruḥ pavamānadhīrāḥ |
Translation: 11 For our sage fathers, Soma Pavamana, of old performed, by thee, their sacred duties.

Sanskit Text: वन्वन्नवातः परिधीन्रपोर्णु वीरेभिरश्वैर्मघवा भवा नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanvannavātaḥ paridhīnraporṇu vīrebhiraśvairmaghavā bhavā naḥ ||
Translation: Fighting unvanquished, open the enclosures: enrich us with large gifts of steeds and heroes.

Sanskit Text: यथापवथा मनवे वयोधा अमित्रहा वरिवोविद धविष्मान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathāpavathā manave vayodhā amitrahā varivovid dhaviṣmān |
Translation: 12 As thou didst flow for Manu Life-bestowing, Foe-queller, Comforter, rich in oblations,

Sanskit Text: एवा पवस्व दरविणं दधान इन्द्रे सं तिष्ठ जनयायुधानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā pavasva draviṇaṃ dadhāna indre saṃ tiṣṭha janayāyudhāni ||
Translation: Even thus flow onward now conferring riches: combine with Indra, and bring forth thy weapons.

Sanskit Text: पवस्व सोम मधुमान रतावापो वसानो अधि सानो अव्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva soma madhumān ṛtāvāpo vasāno adhi sāno avye |
Translation: 13 Flow onward, Soma, rich in sweets and holy,. enrobed in waters on the fleecy summit.

Sanskit Text: अव दरोणानि घर्तवान्ति सीद मदिन्तमो मत्सर इन्द्रपानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava droṇāni ghṛtavānti sīda madintamo matsara indrapānaḥ ||
Translation: Settle in vessels that are full of fatness, as cheering and most gladdening drink for Indra.

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्टिं दिवः शतधारः पवस्व सहस्रसा वाजयुर्देववीतौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṭiṃ divaḥ śatadhāraḥ pavasva sahasrasā vājayurdevavītau |
Translation: 14 Pour, hundred-streamed, winner of thousands, mighty at the Gods’ banquet, Pour the rain of heaven,

Sanskit Text: सं सिन्धुभिः कलशे वावशानः समुस्रियाभिःप्रतिरन न आयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ sindhubhiḥ kalaśe vāvaśānaḥ samusriyābhiḥpratiran na āyuḥ ||
Translation: While thou with rivers roarest in the beaker, and blent with milk prolongest our existence.

Sanskit Text: एष सय सोमो मतिभिः पुनानो.अत्यो न वाजी तरतीदरातीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa sya somo matibhiḥ punāno.atyo na vājī taratīdarātīḥ |
Translation: 15 Purified with our holy hymns, this Soma o’ertakes malignities like some strong charger,

Sanskit Text: पयो न दुग्धमदितेरिषिरमुर्विव गातुः सुयमोन वोळहा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: payo na dughdhamaditeriṣiramurviva ghātuḥ suyamona voḷhā ||
Translation: Like fresh milk poured by Aditi, like passage in ample room, or like a docile car-horse.

Sanskit Text: सवायुधः सोत्र्भिः पूयमानो.अभ्यर्ष गुह्यं चारु नाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāyudhaḥ sotṛbhiḥ pūyamāno.abhyarṣa ghuhyaṃ cāru nāma |
Translation: 16 Cleansed by the pressers, armed with noble weapons, stream to us the fair secret name thou bearest.

Sanskit Text: अभि वाजं सप्तिरिव शरवस्याभि वायुमभि गा देवसोम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi vājaṃ saptiriva śravasyābhi vāyumabhi ghā devasoma ||
Translation: Pour booty, like a horse, for love of glory God, Soma, send us kine, and send us Vāyu.

Sanskit Text: शिशुं जज्ञानं हर्यतं मर्जन्ति शुम्भन्ति वह्निं मरुतो गणेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śiśuṃ jajñānaṃ haryataṃ mṛjanti śumbhanti vahniṃ maruto ghaṇena |
Translation: 17 They deck him at his birth, the lovely Infant, the Maruts with their troop adorn the Car-horse.

Sanskit Text: कविर्गीर्भिः काव्येना कविः सन सोमः पवित्रमत्येति रेभन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kavirghīrbhiḥ kāvyenā kaviḥ san somaḥ pavitramatyeti rebhan ||
Translation: By songs a Poet and a Sage by wisdom, Soma joes singing through the cleansing filter.

Sanskit Text: रषिमना य रषिक्र्त सवर्षाः सहस्रणीथः पदवीः कवीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṣimanā ya ṛṣikṛt svarṣāḥ sahasraṇīthaḥ padavīḥ kavīnām |
Translation: 18 Light-winner, Ṛṣi-mindcd, Ṛṣi-maker, hymned in a thousand hymns, Leader of sages,

Sanskit Text: तर्तीयं धाम महिषः सिषासन सोमो विराजमनुराजति षटुप ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tṛtīyaṃ dhāma mahiṣaḥ siṣāsan somo virājamanurājati ṣṭup ||
Translation: A Steer who strives to gain his third form, Soma is, like Virāj, resplendent as a Singer.

Sanskit Text: चमूषच्छ्येनः शकुनो विभ्र्त्वा गोविन्दुर्द्रप्स आयुधानिबिभ्रत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: camūṣacchyenaḥ śakuno vibhṛtvā ghovindurdrapsa āyudhānibibhrat |
Translation: 19 Hawk seated in the bowls, Bird wide-extended, the Banner seeking kine and wielding weapons,

Sanskit Text: अपामूर्मिं सचमानः समुद्रं तुरीयं धाममहिषो विवक्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāmūrmiṃ sacamānaḥ samudraṃ turīyaṃ dhāmamahiṣo vivakti ||
Translation: Following close the sea, the wave of waters, the great Bull tells his fourth form and declares it.

Sanskit Text: मर्यो न शुभ्रस्तन्वं मर्जानो.अत्यो न सर्त्वा सनये धनानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: maryo na śubhrastanvaṃ mṛjāno.atyo na sṛtvā sanaye dhanānām |
Translation: 20 Like a fair youth who decorates his body, a courser rushing to the gain of riches,

Sanskit Text: वर्षेव यूथा परि कोशमर्षन कनिक्रदच्चम्वोराविवेश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣeva yūthā pari kośamarṣan kanikradaccamvorāviveśa ||
Translation: A steer to herds, so, flowing to the pitcher, he with a roar hath passed into the beakers.

Sanskit Text: पवस्वेन्दो पवमानो महोभिः कनिक्रदत परि वाराण्यर्ष |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasvendo pavamāno mahobhiḥ kanikradat pari vārāṇyarṣa |
Translation: 21 Flow on with might as Pavamana, Indu flow loudly roaring through the fleecy filter.

Sanskit Text: करीळञ्चम्वोरा विश पूयमान इन्द्रं ते रसो मदिरो ममत्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: krīḷañcamvorā viśa pūyamāna indraṃ te raso madiro mamattu ||
Translation: Enter the beakers sporting, as they cleanse thee, and let thy gladdening juice make Indra joyful.

Sanskit Text: परास्य धारा बर्हतीरस्र्ग्रन्नक्तो गोभिः कलशाना विवेश |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāsya dhārā bṛhatīrasṛghrannakto ghobhiḥ kalaśānā viveśa |
Translation: 22 His streams have been effused in all their fulness, and he hath entered, balmed with milk, the goblets.

Sanskit Text: साम कर्ण्वन सामन्यो विपश्चित करन्दन्नेत्यभि सख्युर्न जामिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sāma kṛṇvan sāmanyo vipaścit krandannetyabhi sakhyurna jāmim ||
Translation: Singing his psalm, well-skilled in song, a Chanter, be comes as ’twere to his friend's sister roaring.

Sanskit Text: अपघ्नन्नेषि पवमान शत्रून परियां न जारो अभिगीत इन्दुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apaghnanneṣi pavamāna śatrūn priyāṃ na jāro abhighīta induḥ |
Translation: 23 Chasing our foes thou comest, Pavamana Indu, besting, as lover to his darling.

Sanskit Text: सीदन वनेषु शकुनो न पत्वा सोमः पुनानः कलशेषु सत्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sīdan vaneṣu śakuno na patvā somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sattā ||
Translation: As a bird flies and settles in the forest, thus Soma settles, purified, in goblets.

Sanskit Text: आ ते रुचः पवमानस्य सोम योषेव यन्ति सुदुघाः सुधाराः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā te rucaḥ pavamānasya soma yoṣeva yanti sudughāḥ sudhārāḥ |
Translation: 24 With full stream and abundant milk, O Soma, thy beams come, like a woman, as they cleanse thee.

Sanskit Text: हरिरानीतः पुरुवारो अप्स्वचिक्रदत कलशे देवयूनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: harirānītaḥ puruvāro apsvacikradat kalaśe devayūnām ||
Translation: He, gold-hued, rich in boons, brought to the waters, hath roared within the goblet of the pious.

Sanskit Text: अस्य परेषा हेमना पूयमानो देवो देवेभिः समप्र्क्त रसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya preṣā hemanā pūyamāno devo devebhiḥ samapṛkta rasam |
Translation: 1. MADE pure by this man's urgent zeal and impulse the God hath to the Gods his juice imparted.

Sanskit Text: सुतः पवित्रं पर्येति रेभन मितेव सद्म पशुमान्ति होता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sutaḥ pavitraṃ paryeti rebhan miteva sadma paśumānti hotā ||
Translation: He goes, effused and singing, to the filter, like priest to measured seats supplied with cattle.

Sanskit Text: भद्रा वस्त्रा समन्या वसानो महान कविर्निवचनानि शंसन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadrā vastrā samanyā vasāno mahān kavirnivacanāni śaṃsan |
Translation: 2 Robed in fair raiment meet to wear in battle, a mighty Sage pronouncing invocations.

Sanskit Text: आ वच्यस्व चम्वोः पूयमानो विचक्षणो जाग्र्विर्देववीतौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vacyasva camvoḥ pūyamāno vicakṣaṇo jāghṛvirdevavītau ||
Translation: Roll onward to the beakers as they cleanse thee, far-seeing at the feast of Gods, and watchful.

Sanskit Text: समु परियो मर्ज्यते सानो अव्ये यशस्तरो यशसां कषैतो अस्मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samu priyo mṛjyate sāno avye yaśastaro yaśasāṃ kṣaito asme |
Translation: 3 Dear, he is brightened on the fleecy summit, a Prince among us, nobler than the noble.

Sanskit Text: अभि सवर धन्वा पूयमानो यूयं पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi svara dhanvā pūyamāno yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ ||
Translation: Roar out as thou art purified, run forward. Do ye preserve us evermore with blessings.

Sanskit Text: पर गायताभ्यर्चाम देवान सोमं हिनोत महते धनाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ghāyatābhyarcāma devān somaṃ hinota mahate dhanāya |
Translation: 4 Let us sing praises to the Gods: sing loudly, send ye the Soma forth for mighty riches.

Sanskit Text: सवादुः पवाते अति वारमव्यमा सीदाति कलशं देवयुर्नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāduḥ pavāte ati vāramavyamā sīdāti kalaśaṃ devayurnaḥ ||
Translation: Let him flow, sweetly-flavoured, through the filter, and let our pious one rest in the pitcher.

Sanskit Text: इन्दुर्देवानामुप सख्यमायन सहस्रधारः पवते मदाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indurdevānāmupa sakhyamāyan sahasradhāraḥ pavate madāya |
Translation: 5 Winning the friendship of the Deities, Indu flows in a thousand streams to make them joyful.

Sanskit Text: नर्भिः सतवानो अनु धाम पूर्वमगन्निन्द्रं महते सौभगाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛbhiḥ stavāno anu dhāma pūrvamaghannindraṃ mahate saubhaghāya ||
Translation: Praised by the men after the ancient statute, he hath come nigh, for our great bliss, to Indra.

Sanskit Text: सतोत्रे राये हरिरर्षा पुनान इन्द्रं मदो गछतु ते भराय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stotre rāye harirarṣā punāna indraṃ mado ghachatu te bharāya |
Translation: 6 Flow, Gold-hued, cleansing thee, to enrich the singer: let thy juice go to Indra to support him.

Sanskit Text: देवैर्याहि सरथं राधो अछा यूयं पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devairyāhi sarathaṃ rādho achā yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ ||
Translation: Come nigh, together with the Gods, for bounty. Do ye preserve us evermore with blessings.

Sanskit Text: पर काव्यमुशनेव बरुवाणो देवो देवानां जनिमा विवक्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra kāvyamuśaneva bruvāṇo devo devānāṃ janimā vivakti |
Translation: 7 The God declares the Deities' generations, like Uśanā, proclaiming lofty wisdom.

Sanskit Text: महिव्रतः शुचिबन्धुः पावकः पदा वराहो अभ्येति रेभन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahivrataḥ śucibandhuḥ pāvakaḥ padā varāho abhyeti rebhan ||
Translation: With brilliant kin, far-ruling, sanctifying, the Boar advances, singing, to the places.

Sanskit Text: पर हंसासस्त्र्पलं मन्युमछामादस्तं वर्षगणा अयासुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra haṃsāsastṛpalaṃ manyumachāmādastaṃ vṛṣaghaṇā ayāsuḥ |
Translation: 8 The Swans, the Vrsaganas from anear us have brought their restless spirit to our dwelling.

Sanskit Text: आङगूष्यं पवमानं सखायो दुर्मर्षं साकं परवदन्ति वाणम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āṅghūṣyaṃ pavamānaṃ sakhāyo durmarṣaṃ sākaṃ pravadanti vāṇam ||
Translation: Friends come to Pavamana meet for praises, and sound in concert their resistless music.

Sanskit Text: स रंहत उरुगायस्य जूतिं वर्था करीळन्तं मिमते न गावः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa raṃhata urughāyasya jūtiṃ vṛthā krīḷantaṃ mimate na ghāvaḥ |
Translation: 9 He follows the Wide-strider's rapid movement: cows low, as ’twere, to him who sports at pleasure.

Sanskit Text: परीणसं कर्णुते तिग्मश्र्ङगो दिवा हरिर्दद्र्शे नक्तं रज्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parīṇasaṃ kṛṇute tighmaśṛṅgho divā harirdadṛśe naktaṃ ṛjraḥ ||
Translation: He with the sharpened horns brings forth abundance: the Silvery shines by night, by day the Golden.

Sanskit Text: इन्दुर्वाजी पवते गोन्योघा इन्द्रे सोमः सह इन्वन मदाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indurvājī pavate ghonyoghā indre somaḥ saha invan madāya |
Translation: 10 Strong Indu, bathed in milk, flows on for Indra, Soma exciting strength, to make him joyful.

Sanskit Text: हन्ति रक्षो बाधते पर्यरातीर्वरिवः कर्ण्वन वर्जनस्य राजा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hanti rakṣo bādhate paryarātīrvarivaḥ kṛṇvan vṛjanasya rājā ||
Translation: He quells malignities and slays the demons, the King of mighty power who brings us comfort.

Sanskit Text: अध धारया मध्वा पर्चानस्तिरो रोम पवते अद्रिदुग्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha dhārayā madhvā pṛcānastiro roma pavate adridughdhaḥ |
Translation: 11 Then in a stream he flows, milked out with press-stones, mingled with sweetness, through the fleecy filter-

Sanskit Text: इन्दुरिन्द्रस्य सख्यं जुषाणो देवो देवस्य मत्सरो मदाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indurindrasya sakhyaṃ juṣāṇo devo devasya matsaro madāya ||
Translation: Indu rejoicing in the love of Indra, the God who gladdens, for the God's enjoyment.

Sanskit Text: अभि परियाणि पवते पुनानो देवो देवान सवेन रसेन पर्ञ्चन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi priyāṇi pavate punāno devo devān svena rasena pṛñcan |
Translation: 12 As he is purified he pours out treasures, a God bedewing Gods with his own juices.

Sanskit Text: इन्दुर्धर्माण्य रतुथा वसानो दश कषिपो अव्यत सानो अव्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indurdharmāṇy ṛtuthā vasāno daśa kṣipo avyata sāno avye ||
Translation: Indu hath, wearing qualities by seasons, on the raised fleece engaged, the ten swift fingers.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा शोणो अभिकनिक्रदद गा नदयन्नेति पर्थिवीमुत दयाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā śoṇo abhikanikradad ghā nadayanneti pṛthivīmuta dyām |
Translation: 13 The Red Bull bellowing to the kine advances, causing the heavens and earth to roar and tbunder.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्येव वग्नुरा शर्ण्व आजौ परचेतयन्नर्षति वाचमेमाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasyeva vaghnurā śṛṇva ājau pracetayannarṣati vācamemām ||
Translation: Well is he beard like Indra's shout in battle: letting this voice be known he hastens hither.

Sanskit Text: रसाय्यः पयसा पिन्वमान ईरयन्नेषि मधुमन्तमंशुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rasāyyaḥ payasā pinvamāna īrayanneṣi madhumantamaṃśum |
Translation: 14 Swelling with milk, abounding in sweet flavours, urging the meath-rich plant thou goest onward.

Sanskit Text: पवमानः सन्तनिमेषि कर्ण्वन्निन्द्राय सोम परिषिच्यमानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamānaḥ santanimeṣi kṛṇvannindrāya soma pariṣicyamānaḥ ||
Translation: Raising a shout thou flowest as they cleanse thee, when thou, O Soma, art effused for Indra.

Sanskit Text: एवा पवस्व मदिरो मदायोदग्राभस्य नमयन वधस्नैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā pavasva madiro madāyodaghrābhasya namayan vadhasnaiḥ |
Translation: 15 So flow thou on inspiriting, for rapture, aiming deatb-shafts at him who stays the waters,

Sanskit Text: परि वर्णं भरमाणो रुशन्तं गव्युर्नो अर्ष परि सोम सिक्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari varṇaṃ bharamāṇo ruśantaṃ ghavyurno arṣa pari soma siktaḥ ||
Translation: Flow to us wearing thy resplendent colour, effused and eager for the kine, O Soma.

Sanskit Text: जुष्ट्वी न इन्दो सुपथा सुगान्युरौ पवस्व वरिवांसि कर्ण्वन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣṭvī na indo supathā sughānyurau pavasva varivāṃsi kṛṇvan |
Translation: 16 Pleased with us, Indu, send us as thou flowest good easy paths in ample space and comforts.

Sanskit Text: घनेव विष्वग दुरितानि विघ्नन्नधि षणुना धन्व सानो अव्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghaneva viṣvagh duritāni vighnannadhi ṣṇunā dhanva sāno avye ||
Translation: Dispelling, as ’twere with a club, misfortunes, run o’er the height, run o’er the fleecy summit.

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्टिं नो अर्ष दिव्यां जिगत्नुमिळावतीं शंगयीं जीरदानुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṭiṃ no arṣa divyāṃ jighatnumiḷāvatīṃ śaṃghayīṃ jīradānum |
Translation: 17 Pour on us rain celestial, quickly streaming, refreshing, fraught with health and ready bounty.

Sanskit Text: सतुकेव वीता धन्वा विचिन्वन बन्धून्रिमानवरानिन्दो वायून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stukeva vītā dhanvā vicinvan bandhūnrimānavarānindo vāyūn ||
Translation: Flow, Indu, send these Winds thy lower kinsmen, setting them free like locks of hair unbraided.

Sanskit Text: गरन्थिं न वि षय गरथितं पुनान रजुं च गातुं वर्जिनं च सोम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghranthiṃ na vi ṣya ghrathitaṃ punāna ṛjuṃ ca ghātuṃ vṛjinaṃ ca soma |
Translation: 18 Part, like a knotted tangle, while they cleanse thee, O Soma, righteous and unrighteous conduct.

Sanskit Text: अत्यो न करदो हरिरा सर्जानो मर्यो देव धन्व पस्त्यावान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atyo na krado harirā sṛjāno maryo deva dhanva pastyāvān ||
Translation: Neigh like a tawny courser who is loosened, come like a youth, O God, a house-possessor.

Sanskit Text: जुष्टो मदाय देवतात इन्दो परि षणुना धन्व सानो अव्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣṭo madāya devatāta indo pari ṣṇunā dhanva sāno avye |
Translation: 19 For the God's service, for delight, O Indu, run o’er the height, run o'ver the fleecy summit.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रधारः सुरभिरदब्धः परि सरव वाजसातौ नर्षह्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasradhāraḥ surabhiradabdhaḥ pari srava vājasātau nṛṣahye ||
Translation: With thousand streams, inviolate, sweet-scented, flow on for gain of strength that conquers heroes.

Sanskit Text: अरश्मानो ये.अरथा अयुक्ता अत्यासो न सस्र्जानास आजौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: araśmāno ye.arathā ayuktā atyāso na sasṛjānāsa ājau |
Translation: 20 Without a car, without a rein to guide them, unyoked, like coursers started in the contest,

Sanskit Text: एते शुक्रासो धन्वन्ति सोमा देवासस्तानुप याता पिबध्यै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete śukrāso dhanvanti somā devāsastānupa yātā pibadhyai ||
Translation: These brilliant drops of Soma juice run forward. Do ye, O Deities, come nigh to drink them.

Sanskit Text: एवा न इन्दो अभि देववीतिं परि सरव नभो अर्णश्चमूषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā na indo abhi devavītiṃ pari srava nabho arṇaścamūṣu |
Translation: 21 So for our banquet of the Gods, O Indu, pour down the rain of heaven into the vessels.

Sanskit Text: सोमो अस्मभ्यं काम्यं बर्हन्तं रयिं ददातु वीरवन्तमुग्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somo asmabhyaṃ kāmyaṃ bṛhantaṃ rayiṃ dadātu vīravantamughram ||
Translation: May Soma grant us riches sought with longing, mighty, exceeding strong, with store of heroes.

Sanskit Text: तक्षद यदी मनसो वेनतो वाग जयेष्ठस्य वा धर्मणि कषोरनीके |
Sanskrit Transliteration: takṣad yadī manaso venato vāgh jyeṣṭhasya vā dharmaṇi kṣoranīke |
Translation: 22 What time the loving spirit's word had formed him Chief of all food, by statute of the Highest,

Sanskit Text: आदीमायन वरमा वावशाना जुष्टं पतिं कलशे गाव इन्दुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādīmāyan varamā vāvaśānā juṣṭaṃ patiṃ kalaśe ghāva indum ||
Translation: Then loudly lowing came the cows to Indu, the chosen, well-loved Master in the beaker.

Sanskit Text: पर दानुदो दिव्यो दानुपिन्व रतं रताय पवते सुमेधाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra dānudo divyo dānupinva ṛtaṃ ṛtāya pavate sumedhāḥ |
Translation: 23 The Sage, Celestial, liberal, raining bounties, pours as he flows the Genuine for the Truthful.

Sanskit Text: धर्मा भुवद वर्जन्यस्य राजा पर रश्मिभिर्दशभिर्भारि भूम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dharmā bhuvad vṛjanyasya rājā pra raśmibhirdaśabhirbhāri bhūma ||
Translation: The King shall be effectual strength's upholder: he by the ten bright reins is mostly guided.

Sanskit Text: पवित्रेभिः पवमानो नर्चक्षा राजा देवानामुत मर्त्यानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavitrebhiḥ pavamāno nṛcakṣā rājā devānāmuta martyānām |
Translation: 24 He who beholds mankind, made pure with filters, the King supreme of Deities and mortals,

Sanskit Text: दविता भुवद रयिपती रयीणां रतं भरत सुभ्र्तं चार्विन्दुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvitā bhuvad rayipatī rayīṇāṃ ṛtaṃ bharat subhṛtaṃ cārvinduḥ ||
Translation: From days of old is Treasure-Lord of riches: he, Indu, cherishes fair well-kept Order.

Sanskit Text: अर्वानिव शरवसे सातिमछेन्द्रस्य वायोरभि वीतिमर्ष |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāniva śravase sātimachendrasya vāyorabhi vītimarṣa |
Translation: 25 Haste, like a steed, to vittory for glory, to Indra's and to Vāyu's entertainment.

Sanskit Text: स नः सहस्रा बर्हतीरिषो दा भवा सोम दरविणोवित पुनानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ sahasrā bṛhatīriṣo dā bhavā soma draviṇovit punānaḥ ||
Translation: Give us food ample, thousandfold: be, Soma, the finder-out of riches when they cleanse thee.

Sanskit Text: देवाव्यो नः परिषिच्यमानाः कषयं सुवीरं धन्वन्तु सोमाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāvyo naḥ pariṣicyamānāḥ kṣayaṃ suvīraṃ dhanvantu somāḥ |
Translation: 26 Effused by us let God-delighting Somas bring as they flow a home with noble heroes.

Sanskit Text: आयज्यवः सुमतिं विश्ववारा होतारो न दिवियजो मन्द्रतमाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āyajyavaḥ sumatiṃ viśvavārā hotāro na diviyajo mandratamāḥ ||
Translation: Rich in all boons like priests acquiring favour, the worshippers of heaven, the best of Cheerers.

Sanskit Text: एवा देव देवताते पवस्व महे सोम पसरसे देवपानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā deva devatāte pavasva mahe soma psarase devapānaḥ |
Translation: 27 So, God, for service of the Gods flow onward, flow, drink of Gods, for ample food, O Soma.

Sanskit Text: महश्चिद धि षमसि हिताः समर्ये कर्धि सुष्ठाने रोदसी पुनानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahaścid dhi ṣmasi hitāḥ samarye kṛdhi suṣṭhāne rodasī punānaḥ ||
Translation: For we go forth to war against the mighty make heaven and earth well stablished by thy cleansing.

Sanskit Text: अश्वो नो करदो वर्षभिर्युजानः सिंहो न भीमो मनसो जवीयान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvo no krado vṛṣabhiryujānaḥ siṃho na bhīmo manaso javīyān |
Translation: 28 Thou, yoked by strong men, neighest like a courser, swifter than thought is, like an awful lion.

Sanskit Text: अर्वाचीनैः पथिभिर्ये रजिष्ठा आ पवस्व सौमनसं न इन्दो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvācīnaiḥ pathibhirye rajiṣṭhā ā pavasva saumanasaṃ na indo ||
Translation: By paths directed hitherward, the straightest, send thou us happiness, Indu, while they cleanse thee.

Sanskit Text: शतं धारा देवजाता अस्र्ग्रन सहस्रमेनाः कवयो मर्जन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ dhārā devajātā asṛghran sahasramenāḥ kavayo mṛjanti |
Translation: 29 Sprung from the Gods, a hundred streams, a thousand, have been effused: sages prepare and purge them.

Sanskit Text: इन्दो सनित्रं दिव आ पवस्व पुरेतासि महतो धनस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indo sanitraṃ diva ā pavasva puraetāsi mahato dhanasya ||
Translation: Bring us from heaven the means of winnning, Indu; thou art-forerunnner of abundant riches.

Sanskit Text: दिवो न सर्गा असस्र्ग्रमह्नां राजा न मित्रं पर मिनातिधीरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo na sarghā asasṛghramahnāṃ rājā na mitraṃ pra minātidhīraḥ |
Translation: 30 The streams of days, were poured as ’twere from heaven: the wise King doth not treat his friend unkindly.

Sanskit Text: पितुर्न पुत्रः करतुभिर्यतान आ पवस्व विशेस्या अजीतिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: piturna putraḥ kratubhiryatāna ā pavasva viśeasyā ajītim ||
Translation: Like a son following his father's wishes, grant to this family success and safety.

Sanskit Text: पर ते धारा मधुमतीरस्र्ग्रन वारान यत पूतो अत्येष्यव्यान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te dhārā madhumatīrasṛghran vārān yat pūto atyeṣyavyān |
Translation: 31 Now are thy streams poured forth with all their sweetness, when, purified. thou goest through the filter.

Sanskit Text: पवमान पवसे धाम गोनां जज्ञानः सूर्यमपिन्वो अर्कैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamāna pavase dhāma ghonāṃ jajñānaḥ sūryamapinvo arkaiḥ ||
Translation: The race of kine is thy gift, Pavarridna: when born thou madest Sūrya rich with brightness.

Sanskit Text: कनिक्रददनु पन्थां रतस्य शुक्रो वि भास्यम्र्तस्य धाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kanikradadanu panthāṃ ṛtasya śukro vi bhāsyamṛtasya dhāma |
Translation: 32 Bright, bellowing aiong the path of Order, thou shinest as the form of life eternal.

Sanskit Text: स इन्द्राय पवसे मत्सरवान हिन्वानो वाचं मतिभिः कवीनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa indrāya pavase matsaravān hinvāno vācaṃ matibhiḥ kavīnām ||
Translation: Thou flowest on as gladdening drink for Indra, sending thy voice out with the hymns of sages.

Sanskit Text: दिव्यः सुपर्णो.अव चक्षि सोम पिन्वन धाराः कर्मणा देववीतौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divyaḥ suparṇo.ava cakṣi soma pinvan dhārāḥ karmaṇā devavītau |
Translation: 33 Pouring out streams at the Gods’ feast with service, thou, Soma, lookest down, a heavenly Eagle.

Sanskit Text: एन्दो विश कलशं सोमधानं करन्दन्निहि सूर्यस्योप रश्मिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: endo viśa kalaśaṃ somadhānaṃ krandannihi sūryasyopa raśmim ||
Translation: Enter the Soma-holding beaker, Indu, and with a roar approach the ray of Sarya.

Sanskit Text: तिस्रो वाच ईरयति पर वह्निरतस्य धीतिं बरह्मणो मनीषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisro vāca īrayati pra vahnirtasya dhītiṃ brahmaṇo manīṣām |
Translation: 34 Three are the voices that the Courser utters: he speaks the thought of prayer, the law of Order.

Sanskit Text: गावो यन्ति गोपतिं पर्छमानाः सोमं यन्ति मतयो वावशानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāvo yanti ghopatiṃ pṛchamānāḥ somaṃ yanti matayo vāvaśānāḥ ||
Translation: To the Cow's Master come the Cows inquiring: the hymns with eager longing come to Soma.

Sanskit Text: सोमं गावो धेनवो वावशानाः सोमं विप्रा मतिभिः पर्छमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaṃ ghāvo dhenavo vāvaśānāḥ somaṃ viprā matibhiḥ pṛchamānāḥ |
Translation: 35 To Soma come the Cows, the Milch-kine longing, to Soma sages with their hvmns inquiring.

Sanskit Text: सोमः सुतः पूयते अज्यमानः सोमे अर्कास्त्रिष्टुभिः सं नवन्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaḥ sutaḥ pūyate ajyamānaḥ some arkāstriṣṭubhiḥ saṃ navante ||
Translation: Soma, effused, is purified and blended our hymns and Tṛṣṭup songs unite in Soma.

Sanskit Text: एवा नः सोम परिषिच्यमान आ पवस्व पूयमानः सवस्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā naḥ soma pariṣicyamāna ā pavasva pūyamānaḥ svasti |
Translation: 36 Thus, Soma, as we pour thee into vessels, while thou art purified flow for our welfare.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रमा विश बर्हता रवेण वर्धया वाचं जनया पुरन्धिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indramā viśa bṛhatā raveṇa vardhayā vācaṃ janayā purandhim ||
Translation: Pass into Indra with a mighty roaring make the voice swell, and generate abundance.

Sanskit Text: आ जाग्र्विर्विप्र रता मतीनां सोमः पुनानो असदच्चमूषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā jāghṛvirvipra ṛtā matīnāṃ somaḥ punāno asadaccamūṣu |
Translation: 37 Singer of true songs, ever-watchful, Soma hath settled in the ladles when they cleanse him.

Sanskit Text: सपन्ति यं मिथुनासो निकामा अध्वर्यवो रथिरासः सुहस्ताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sapanti yaṃ mithunāso nikāmā adhvaryavo rathirāsaḥ suhastāḥ ||
Translation: Him the Adhvaryus, paired and eager, follow, leaders of sacrifice and skilful-handed.

Sanskit Text: स पुनान उप सूरे न धातोभे अप्रा रोदसी वि ष आवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa punāna upa sūre na dhātobhe aprā rodasī vi ṣa āvaḥ |
Translation: 38 Cleansed near the Sun as ’twere he as Creator hath filled full heaven and earth, and hath disclosed them.

Sanskit Text: परिया चिद यस्य परियसास ऊती स तू धनं कारिणेन पर यंसत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyā cid yasya priyasāsa ūtī sa tū dhanaṃ kāriṇena pra yaṃsat ||
Translation: He by whose dear help men gain all their wishes shall yield the precious meed as to a victor.

Sanskit Text: स वर्धिता वर्धनः पूयमानः सोमो मीढ्वानभि नो जयोतिषावीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vardhitā vardhanaḥ pūyamānaḥ somo mīḍhvānabhi no jyotiṣāvīt |
Translation: 39 He, being cleansed, the Strengthener and Increaser, Soma the Bounteous, helped us with his lustre,

Sanskit Text: येना नः पूर्वे पितरः पदज्ञाः सवर्विदो अभि गा अद्रिमुष्णन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ padajñāḥ svarvido abhi ghā adrimuṣṇan ||
Translation: Wherewith our sires of old who knew the footsteps found light and stole the cattle from the mountain.

Sanskit Text: अक्रान समुद्रः परथमे विधर्मञ जनयन परजा भुवनस्यराजा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: akrān samudraḥ prathame vidharmañ janayan prajā bhuvanasyarājā |
Translation: 40 In the first vault of heaven loud roared the Ocean, King of all being, generating creatures.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा पवित्रे अधि सानो अव्ये बर्हत सोमो वाव्र्धे सुवान इन्दुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā pavitre adhi sāno avye bṛhat somo vāvṛdhe suvāna induḥ ||
Translation: Steer, in the filter, on the fleecy summit, Soma, the Drop effused, hath waxen mighty.

Sanskit Text: महत तत सोमो महिषश्चकारापां यद गर्भो.अव्र्णीत देवान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahat tat somo mahiṣaścakārāpāṃ yad gharbho.avṛṇīta devān |
Translation: 41 Soma the Steer, in that as Child of Waters he chose the Gods, performed that great achievement.

Sanskit Text: अदधादिन्द्रे पवमान ओजो.अजनयत सूर्ये जयोतिरिन्दुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adadhādindre pavamāna ojo.ajanayat sūrye jyotirinduḥ ||
Translation: He, Pavamana, granted strength to Indra; he, Indu, generated light in Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: मत्सि वायुमिष्टये राधसे च मत्सि मित्रावरुणा पूयमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: matsi vāyumiṣṭaye rādhase ca matsi mitrāvaruṇā pūyamānaḥ |
Translation: 42 Make Vāyu glad,, for furtherance and bounty: cheer Varuṇa and Mitra, as they cleanse thee.

Sanskit Text: मत्सि शर्धो मारुतं मत्सि देवान मत्सि दयावाप्र्थिवी देव सोम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: matsi śardho mārutaṃ matsi devān matsi dyāvāpṛthivī deva soma ||
Translation: Gladden the Gods, gladden the host of Maruts: make Heaven and Earth rejoice, O God, O Soma.

Sanskit Text: रजुः पवस्व वर्जिनस्य हन्तापामीवां बाधमानो मर्धश्च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛjuḥ pavasva vṛjinasya hantāpāmīvāṃ bādhamāno mṛdhaśca |
Translation: 43 Flow onward righteous slayer of the wicked, driving away our enemies and sickness,

Sanskit Text: अभिश्रीणन पयः पयसाभि गोनामिन्द्रस्य तवं तव वयं सखायः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhiśrīṇan payaḥ payasābhi ghonāmindrasya tvaṃ tava vayaṃ sakhāyaḥ ||
Translation: Blending thy milk with milk which cows afford us. We are thy friends, thou art the Friend of Indra.

Sanskit Text: मध्वः सूदं पवस्व वस्व उत्सं वीरं च न आ पवस्वा भगं च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhvaḥ sūdaṃ pavasva vasva utsaṃ vīraṃ ca na ā pavasvā bhaghaṃ ca |
Translation: 44 Pour us a fount of meath, a spring of treasure; send us a hero son and happy fortune.

Sanskit Text: सवदस्वेन्द्राय पवमान इन्दो रयिं च न आ पवस्वा समुद्रात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svadasvendrāya pavamāna indo rayiṃ ca na ā pavasvā samudrāt ||
Translation: Be sweet to India when they cleanse thee, Indu, and pour down riches on us from the ocean.

Sanskit Text: सोमः सुतो धारयात्यो न हित्वा सिन्धुर्न निम्नमभि वाज्यक्षाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaḥ suto dhārayātyo na hitvā sindhurna nimnamabhi vājyakṣāḥ |
Translation: 45 Strong Soma, pressed, like an impetuous courser, hath flowed in stream as a flood speeding downward.

Sanskit Text: आ योनिं वन्यमसदत पुनानः समिन्दुर्गोभिरसरत समद्भिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yoniṃ vanyamasadat punānaḥ samindurghobhirasarat samadbhiḥ ||
Translation: Cleansed, he hath settled in his wooden dwelling: Indu hath flowed with milk and with the waters.

Sanskit Text: एष सय ते पवत इन्द्र सोमश्चमूषु धीर उशते तवस्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa sya te pavata indra somaścamūṣu dhīra uśate tavasvān |
Translation: 46 Strong, wise, for thee who longest for his coming this Soma here flows to the bowls, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: सवर्चक्षा रथिरः सत्यशुष्मः कामो न यो देवयतामसर्जि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svarcakṣā rathiraḥ satyaśuṣmaḥ kāmo na yo devayatāmasarji ||
Translation: He, chariot-borne, sun-bright, and truly potent, was poured forth like the longing of the pious.

Sanskit Text: एष परत्नेन वयसा पुनानस्तिरो वर्पांसि दुहितुर्दधानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa pratnena vayasā punānastiro varpāṃsi duhiturdadhānaḥ |
Translation: 47 He, purified with ancient vital vigour, pervading all his Daughter's forms and figures,

Sanskit Text: वसानः शर्म तरिवरूथमप्सु होतेव याति समनेषुरेभन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasānaḥ śarma trivarūthamapsu hoteva yāti samaneṣurebhan ||
Translation: Finding his threefold refuge in the waters, goes singing, as a priest, to the assemblies.

Sanskit Text: नू नस्त्वं रथिरो देव सोम परि सरव चम्वोः पूयमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nū nastvaṃ rathiro deva soma pari srava camvoḥ pūyamānaḥ |
Translation: 48 Now, chariot-borne, flow unto us, God Soma, as thou art purified flow to the saucers,

Sanskit Text: अप्सु सवादिष्ठो मधुमान रतावा देवो न यः सविता सत्यमन्मा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apsu svādiṣṭho madhumān ṛtāvā devo na yaḥ savitā satyamanmā ||
Translation: Sweetest in waters, rich in meath, and holy, as Savitar the God is, truthfulminded.

Sanskit Text: अभि वायुं वीत्यर्षा गर्णानो.अभि मित्रावरुणा पूयमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi vāyuṃ vītyarṣā ghṛṇāno.abhi mitrāvaruṇā pūyamānaḥ |
Translation: 49 To feast him, flow mid song and hymn, to Vāyu, flow purified to Varuṇa and Mitra.

Sanskit Text: अभी नरं धीजवनं रथेष्ठामभीन्द्रं वर्षणं वज्रबाहुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhī naraṃ dhījavanaṃ ratheṣṭhāmabhīndraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vajrabāhum ||
Translation: Flow to the song-inspiring car-borne Hero, to mighty Indra, him who wields the thunder.

Sanskit Text: अभि वस्त्रा सुवसनान्यर्षाभि धेनूः सुदुघाः पूयमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi vastrā suvasanānyarṣābhi dhenūḥ sudughāḥ pūyamānaḥ |
Translation: 50 Pour on us garments that shall clothe us meetly, send, purified, miIch-kine, abundant yielders.

Sanskit Text: अभि चन्द्रा भर्तवे नो हिरण्याभ्यश्वान रथिनो देव सोम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi candrā bhartave no hiraṇyābhyaśvān rathino deva soma ||
Translation: God Soma, send us chariot-drawing horses that they may bring us treasures bright and golden.

Sanskit Text: अभी नो अर्ष दिव्या वसून्यभि विश्वा पार्थिवा पूयमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhī no arṣa divyā vasūnyabhi viśvā pārthivā pūyamānaḥ |
Translation: 51 Send to us in a stream celestial riches, send us, when thou art cleansed, what earth containeth,

Sanskit Text: अभि येन दरविणमश्नवामाभ्यर्षेयं जमदग्निवन्नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi yena draviṇamaśnavāmābhyarṣeyaṃ jamadaghnivannaḥ ||
Translation: So that thereby we may acquire possessions and Rsihood in Jamadagni's manner.

Sanskit Text: अया पवा पवस्वैना वसूनि मांश्चत्व इन्दो सरसि पर धन्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayā pavā pavasvainā vasūni māṃścatva indo sarasi pra dhanva |
Translation: 52 Pour forth this wealth with this purification: flow onward to the yellow lake, O Indu.

Sanskit Text: बरध्नश्चिदत्र वातो न जातः पुरुमेधश्चित तकवे नरं दात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bradhnaścidatra vāto na jātaḥ purumedhaścit takave naraṃ dāt ||
Translation: Here, too, the Ruddy, wind-swift, full of wisdom, Shall give a son to him who cometh quickly.

Sanskit Text: उत न एना पवया पवस्वाधि शरुते शरवाय्यस्य तीर्थे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta na enā pavayā pavasvādhi śrute śravāyyasya tīrthe |
Translation: 53 Flow on for us with this purification to the famed ford of thee whose due is glory.

Sanskit Text: षष्टिं सहस्रा नैगुतो वसूनि वर्क्षं न पक्वं धूनवद रणाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrā naighuto vasūni vṛkṣaṃ na pakvaṃ dhūnavad raṇāya ||
Translation: May the Foe-queller shake us down, for triumph, like a tree's ripe fruit, sixty thousand treasures.

Sanskit Text: महीमे अस्य वर्षनाम शूषे मांश्चत्वे वा पर्शने वा वधत्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahīme asya vṛṣanāma śūṣe māṃścatve vā pṛśane vā vadhatre |
Translation: 54 Eagerly do we pray for those two exploits, at the blue lake and Prsana, wrought in battle.

Sanskit Text: अस्वापयन निगुतः सनेहयच्चापामित्रानपाचितो अचेतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asvāpayan nighutaḥ snehayaccāpāmitrānapācito acetaḥ ||
Translation: He sent our enemies to sleep and slew thern, and turned away the foolish and unfriendly.

Sanskit Text: सं तरी पवित्रा विततान्येष्यन्वेकं धावसि पूयमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ trī pavitrā vitatānyeṣyanvekaṃ dhāvasi pūyamānaḥ |
Translation: 55 Thou comest unto three extended filters, and hasteriest through each one as they cleanse thee.

Sanskit Text: असि भगो असि दात्रस्य दातासि मघवा मघवद्भ्य इन्दो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asi bhagho asi dātrasya dātāsi maghavā maghavadbhya indo ||
Translation: Thou art the giver of the gift, a Bhaga, a Maghavan for liberal lords, O Indu.

Sanskit Text: एष विश्ववित पवते मनीषी सोमो विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa viśvavit pavate manīṣī somo viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā |
Translation: 56 This Soma here, the Wise, the All-obtainer, flows on his way as King of all existence.

Sanskit Text: दरप्सानीरयन विदथेष्विन्दुर्वि वारमव्यं समयाति याति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: drapsānīrayan vidatheṣvindurvi vāramavyaṃ samayāti yāti ||
Translation: Driving the drops at our assemblies, Indu completely traverses the fleecy filter.

Sanskit Text: इन्दुं रिहन्ति महिषा अदब्धाः पदे रेभन्ति कवयो न गर्ध्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: induṃ rihanti mahiṣā adabdhāḥ pade rebhanti kavayo na ghṛdhrāḥ |
Translation: 57 The Great Inviolate are kissing Indu, and singing in his place like eager sages.

Sanskit Text: हिन्वन्ति धीरा दशभिः कषिपाभिः समञ्जते रूपमपां रसेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hinvanti dhīrā daśabhiḥ kṣipābhiḥ samañjate rūpamapāṃ rasena ||
Translation: The wise men send him forth with ten swift fingers, and balm his form with essence of the waters.

Sanskit Text: तवया वयं पवमानेन सोम भरे कर्तं वि चिनुयाम शश्वत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā vayaṃ pavamānena soma bhare kṛtaṃ vi cinuyāma śaśvat |
Translation: 58 Soma, may we, with thee as Pavamana, pile up together all our spoil in battle.

Sanskit Text: तन नो मित्रो वरुणो मामहन्तामदितिः सिन्धुः पर्थिवीुत दयौः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantāmaditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivīuta dyauḥ ||
Translation: This boon vouchsafe us Varuṇa and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: अभि नो वाजसातमं रयिमर्ष पुरुस्प्र्हम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi no vājasātamaṃ rayimarṣa puruspṛham |
Translation: 1. STREAM on us riches that are sought by many, best at winning strength

Sanskit Text: इन्दो सहस्रभर्णसं तुविद्युम्नं विभ्वासहम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indo sahasrabharṇasaṃ tuvidyumnaṃ vibhvāsaham ||
Translation: Riches, O Indu, thousandfold, glorious, conquering the great.

Sanskit Text: परि षय सुवानो अव्ययं रथे न वर्माव्यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari ṣya suvāno avyayaṃ rathe na varmāvyata |
Translation: 2 Effused, he hath, as on a car, invested him in fleecy mail:

Sanskit Text: इन्दुरभिद्रुणा हितो हियानो धाराभिरक्षाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indurabhidruṇā hito hiyāno dhārābhirakṣāḥ ||
Translation: Onward hath Indu flowed in streams, impelled, surrounded by the wood.

Sanskit Text: परि षय सुवानो अक्षा इन्दुरव्ये मदच्युतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari ṣya suvāno akṣā induravye madacyutaḥ |
Translation: 3 Effused, this Indu hath flowed on, distilling rapture, to the fleece:

Sanskit Text: धारा य ऊर्ध्वो अध्वरे भराजा नैति गव्ययुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhārā ya ūrdhvo adhvare bhrājā naiti ghavyayuḥ ||
Translation: He goes erect, as seeking kine in stream, with light, to sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: स हि तवं देव शश्वते वसु मर्ताय दाशुषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi tvaṃ deva śaśvate vasu martāya dāśuṣe |
Translation: 4 For thou thyself, O Indu, God, to every mortal worshipper

Sanskit Text: इन्दो सहस्रिणं रयिं शतात्मानं विवाससि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indo sahasriṇaṃ rayiṃ śatātmānaṃ vivāsasi ||
Translation: Attractest riches thousandfold, made manifest in hundred forms.

Sanskit Text: वयं ते अस्य वर्त्रहन वसो वस्वः पुरुस्प्र्हः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ te asya vṛtrahan vaso vasvaḥ puruspṛhaḥ |
Translation: 5 Good Vṛtra-slayer, may we be still nearest to this wealth of thine

Sanskit Text: नि नेदिष्ठतमा इषः सयाम सुम्नस्याध्रिगो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni nediṣṭhatamā iṣaḥ syāma sumnasyādhrigho ||
Translation: Which many crave, nearest to food and happiness, Resistless One!

Sanskit Text: दविर्यं पञ्च सवयशसं सवसारो अद्रिसंहतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dviryaṃ pañca svayaśasaṃ svasāro adrisaṃhatam |
Translation: 6 Whom, bright with native splendour, crushed between the pair of pressingstones-

Sanskit Text: परियमिन्द्रस्य काम्यं परस्नापयन्त्यूर्मिणम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyamindrasya kāmyaṃ prasnāpayantyūrmiṇam ||
Translation: The wavy Friend whom Indra loves-the twice-five sisters dip and bathe,

Sanskit Text: परि तयं हर्यतं हरिं बभ्रुं पुनन्ति वारेण |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari tyaṃ haryataṃ hariṃ babhruṃ punanti vāreṇa |
Translation: 7 Him with the fleece they purify, brown, golden-hued, beloved of all,

Sanskit Text: यो देवान विश्वानित परि मदेन सह गछति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo devān viśvānit pari madena saha ghachati ||
Translation: Who with exhilarating juice goes forth to all the Deities.

Sanskit Text: अस्य वो हयवसा पान्तो दक्षसाधनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya vo hyavasā pānto dakṣasādhanam |
Translation: 8 Through longing for this sap of yours ye drink what brings ability,

Sanskit Text: यः सूरिषु शरवोब्र्हद दधे सवर्ण हर्यतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ sūriṣu śravobṛhad dadhe svarṇa haryataḥ ||
Translation: Even him who, dear as heaven's own light, gives to our princes high renown.

Sanskit Text: स वां यज्ञेषु मानवी इन्दुर्जनिष्ट रोदसी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vāṃ yajñeṣu mānavī indurjaniṣṭa rodasī |
Translation: 9 Indu at holy rites produced you, Heaven and Earth, the Friends of men,

Sanskit Text: देवो देवी गिरिष्ठा अस्रेधन तं तुविष्वणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devo devī ghiriṣṭhā asredhan taṃ tuviṣvaṇi ||
Translation: Hill-haunting God the Goddesses. They bruised him where the roar was loud.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय सोम पातवे वर्त्रघ्ने परि षिच्यसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya soma pātave vṛtraghne pari ṣicyase |
Translation: 10 For Vṛtra-slaying Indra, thou, Soma, art poured that he may drink,

Sanskit Text: नरे च दक्षिणावते देवाय सदनासदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nare ca dakṣiṇāvate devāya sadanāsade ||
Translation: Poured for the guerdon-giving man, poured for the God who sitteth there.

Sanskit Text: ते परत्नासो वयुष्टिषु सोमाः पवित्रे अक्षरन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te pratnāso vyuṣṭiṣu somāḥ pavitre akṣaran |
Translation: 11 These ancient Somas, at the break of day, have flowed into the sieve,

Sanskit Text: अपप्रोथन्तः सनुतर्हुरश्चितः परातस्तानप्रचेतसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apaprothantaḥ sanutarhuraścitaḥ prātastānapracetasaḥ ||
Translation: Snorting away at early morn these foolish evil-hearted ones.

Sanskit Text: तं सखायः पुरोरुचं यूयं वयं च सूरयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ sakhāyaḥ purorucaṃ yūyaṃ vayaṃ ca sūrayaḥ |
Translation: 12 Friends, may the princes, ye and we, obtain this Most Resplendent One.

Sanskit Text: अश्याम वाजगन्ध्यं सनेम वाजपस्त्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśyāma vājaghandhyaṃ sanema vājapastyam ||
Translation: Gain him who hath the smell of strength, win him whose home is very strength.

Sanskit Text: आ हर्यताय धर्ष्णवे धनुस्तन्वन्ति पौंस्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā haryatāya dhṛṣṇave dhanustanvanti pauṃsyam |
Translation: 1. THEY for the Bold and Lovely One ply manly vigour like a bow:

Sanskit Text: शुक्रांवयन्त्यसुराय निर्णिजं विपामग्रे महीयुवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śukrāṃvayantyasurāya nirṇijaṃ vipāmaghre mahīyuvaḥ ||
Translation: joyous, in front of songs they weave bright raiment for the Lord Divine.

Sanskit Text: अध कषपा परिष्क्र्तो वाजानभि पर गाहते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha kṣapā pariṣkṛto vājānabhi pra ghāhate |
Translation: 2 And he, made beautiful by night, dips forward into strengthening food',

Sanskit Text: यदी विवस्वतो धियो हरिं हिन्वन्ति यातवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadī vivasvato dhiyo hariṃ hinvanti yātave ||
Translation: What time the sacrificer's thoughts speed on his way the Golden-hued.

Sanskit Text: तमस्य मर्जयामसि मदो य इन्द्रपातमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamasya marjayāmasi mado ya indrapātamaḥ |
Translation: 3 We cleanse this gladdening drink of his the juice which Indra chiefly drinks—-

Sanskit Text: यं गाव आसभिर्दधुः पुरा नूनं च सूरयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ ghāva āsabhirdadhuḥ purā nūnaṃ ca sūrayaḥ ||
Translation: That which kine took into their mouths, of old, and princes take it now.

Sanskit Text: तं गाथया पुराण्या पुनानमभ्यनूषत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ ghāthayā purāṇyā punānamabhyanūṣata |
Translation: 4 To him, while purifying, they have raised the ancient psalm of praise:

Sanskit Text: उतो कर्पन्तधीतयो देवानां नाम बिभ्रतीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto kṛpantadhītayo devānāṃ nāma bibhratīḥ ||
Translation: And sacred songs which bear the names of Gods have supplicated him.

Sanskit Text: तमुक्षमाणमव्यये वारे पुनन्ति धर्णसिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamukṣamāṇamavyaye vāre punanti dharṇasim |
Translation: 5 They purify him as he drops, courageous, in the fleecy sieve.

Sanskit Text: दूतं न पूर्वचित्तय आ शासते मनीषिणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūtaṃ na pūrvacittaya ā śāsate manīṣiṇaḥ ||
Translation: Him they instruct as messenger to bear the sage's morning prayer.

Sanskit Text: स पुनानो मदिन्तमः सोमश्चमूषु सीदति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa punāno madintamaḥ somaścamūṣu sīdati |
Translation: 6 Soma, best Cheerer, takes his seat, the while they cleanse him in the bowls.

Sanskit Text: पशौ न रेत आदधत पतिर्वचस्यते धियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: paśau na reta ādadhat patirvacasyate dhiyaḥ ||
Translation: He as it were impregns the cow, and babbles on, the Lord of Song.

Sanskit Text: स मर्ज्यते सुकर्मभिर्देवो देवेभ्यः सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa mṛjyate sukarmabhirdevo devebhyaḥ sutaḥ |
Translation: 7 He is effused and beautified, a God for Gods, by skilful men.

Sanskit Text: विदे यदासु सन्ददिर्महीरपो वि गाहते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vide yadāsu sandadirmahīrapo vi ghāhate ||
Translation: He penetrates the mighty floods collecting all he knows therein.

Sanskit Text: सुत इन्दो पवित्र आ नर्भिर्यतो वि नीयसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suta indo pavitra ā nṛbhiryato vi nīyase |
Translation: 8 Pressed, Indu, guided by the men, thou art led to the cleaning sieve.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय मत्सरिन्तमश्चमूष्वा नि षीदसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya matsarintamaścamūṣvā ni ṣīdasi ||
Translation: Thou, yielding Indra highest joy, takest thy seat within the bowls.

Sanskit Text: अभी नवन्ते अद्रुहः परियमिन्द्रस्य काम्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhī navante adruhaḥ priyamindrasya kāmyam |
Translation: 1. THE Guileless Ones are singing praise to Indra's well beloved Friend,

Sanskit Text: वत्सं न पूर्व आयुनि जातं रिहन्ति मातरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vatsaṃ na pūrva āyuni jātaṃ rihanti mātaraḥ ||
Translation: As, in the morning of its life, the mothers lick the new-born calf.

Sanskit Text: पुनान इन्दवा भर सोम दविबर्हसं रयिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: punāna indavā bhara soma dvibarhasaṃ rayim |
Translation: 2 O Indu, while they cleanse thee bring, O Soma, doubly-waxing wealth

Sanskit Text: तवं वसूनिपुष्यसि विश्वानि दाशुषो गर्हे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ vasūnipuṣyasi viśvāni dāśuṣo ghṛhe ||
Translation: Thou in the worshipper's abode causest all treasures to increase.

Sanskit Text: तवं धियं मनोयुजं सर्जा वर्ष्टिं न तन्यतुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ dhiyaṃ manoyujaṃ sṛjā vṛṣṭiṃ na tanyatuḥ |
Translation: 3 Set free the. song which mind hath yoked, even as thunder frees the rain:

Sanskit Text: तवं वसूनि पार्थिवा दिव्या च सोम पुष्यसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ vasūni pārthivā divyā ca soma puṣyasi ||
Translation: All treasures of the earth and heaven, O Soma, thou dost multiply.

Sanskit Text: परि ते जिग्युषो यथा धारा सुतस्य धावति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari te jighyuṣo yathā dhārā sutasya dhāvati |
Translation: 4 Thy stream when thou art pressed runs on like some victorious warrior's steed

Sanskit Text: रंहमाणाव्यव्ययं वारं वाजीव सानसिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: raṃhamāṇāvyavyayaṃ vāraṃ vājīva sānasiḥ ||
Translation: Hastening onward through the fleece like a fierce horse who wins the prize.

Sanskit Text: करत्वे दक्षाय नः कवे पवस्व सोम धारया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratve dakṣāya naḥ kave pavasva soma dhārayā |
Translation: 5 Flow on, Sage Soma, with thy stream to give us mental power and strength,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय पातवे सुतो मित्राय वरुणाय च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya pātave suto mitrāya varuṇāya ca ||
Translation: Effused for Indra, for his drink, for Mitra and for Varuṇa.

Sanskit Text: पवस्व वाजसातमः पवित्रे धारया सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva vājasātamaḥ pavitre dhārayā sutaḥ |
Translation: 6 Flow to the filter with thy stream, effused, best winner, thou, of spoil,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय सोमविष्णवे देवेभ्यो मधुमत्तमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya somaviṣṇave devebhyo madhumattamaḥ ||
Translation: O Soma, as most rich in sweets for Indra, Viṣṇu, and the Gods.

Sanskit Text: तवां रिहन्ति मातरो हरिं पवित्रे अद्रुहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ rihanti mātaro hariṃ pavitre adruhaḥ |
Translation: 7 The mothers, void of guiles, caress thee Golden-coloured, in the sieve,

Sanskit Text: वत्सं जातंन धेनवः पवमान विधर्मणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vatsaṃ jātaṃna dhenavaḥ pavamāna vidharmaṇi ||
Translation: As cows, O Pavamana, lick the new-born calf, as Law commands.

Sanskit Text: पवमान महि शरवश्चित्रेभिर्यासि रश्मिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavamāna mahi śravaścitrebhiryāsi raśmibhiḥ |
Translation: 8 Thou, Pavamana, movest on with wondrous rays to great renown.

Sanskit Text: शर्धन तमांसि जिघ्नसे विश्वानि दाशुषो गर्हे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śardhan tamāṃsi jighnase viśvāni dāśuṣo ghṛhe ||
Translation: Striving within the votary's house thou drivest all the glooms away.

Sanskit Text: तवं दयां च महिव्रत पर्थिवीं चाति जभ्रिषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ dyāṃ ca mahivrata pṛthivīṃ cāti jabhriṣe |
Translation: 9 Lord of great sway, thou liftest thee above the heavens, above the earth.

Sanskit Text: परति दरापिममुञ्चथाः पवमान महित्वना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati drāpimamuñcathāḥ pavamāna mahitvanā ||
Translation: Thou, Pavamana hast assumed thy coat of mail in majesty.

Sanskit Text: पुरोजिती वो अन्धसः सुताय मादयित्नवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purojitī vo andhasaḥ sutāya mādayitnave |
Translation: 1. FOR first possession of your juice, for the exhilarating drink,

Sanskit Text: अप शवानं शनथिष्टन सखायो दीर्घजिह्व्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa śvānaṃ śnathiṣṭana sakhāyo dīrghajihvyam ||
Translation: Drive ye away the dog, my friends, drive ye the long-tongued dog away.

Sanskit Text: यो धारया पावकया परिप्रस्यन्दते सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo dhārayā pāvakayā pariprasyandate sutaḥ |
Translation: 2 He who with purifying stream, effused, comes flowing hitherward,

Sanskit Text: इन्दुरश्वो न कर्त्व्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: induraśvo na kṛtvyaḥ ||
Translation: Indu, is like an able steed.

Sanskit Text: तं दुरोषमभी नरः सोमं विश्वाच्या धिया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ duroṣamabhī naraḥ somaṃ viśvācyā dhiyā |
Translation: 3 The men with all-pervading song send unassailable Soma forth,

Sanskit Text: यज्ञं हिन्वन्त्यद्रिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñaṃ hinvantyadribhiḥ ||
Translation: By pressing-stones, to sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: सुतासो मधुमत्तमाः सोमा इन्द्राय मन्दिनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sutāso madhumattamāḥ somā indrāya mandinaḥ |
Translation: 4 The Somas, very rich in sweets, for which the sieve is destined, flow,

Sanskit Text: पवित्रवन्तोक्षरन देवान गछन्तु वो मदाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavitravantoakṣaran devān ghachantu vo madāḥ ||
Translation: Effused, the source of Indra's joy: may your strong juices reach the Gods.

Sanskit Text: इन्दुरिन्द्राय पवत इति देवासो अब्रुवन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indurindrāya pavata iti devāso abruvan |
Translation: 5 Indu flows on for Indra's sake: thus have the Deities declared.

Sanskit Text: वाचस पतिर्मखस्यते विश्वस्येशान ओजसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vācas patirmakhasyate viśvasyeśāna ojasā ||
Translation: The Lord of Speech exerts himself, Ruler of all, because of might.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रधारः पवते समुद्रो वाचमीङखयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasradhāraḥ pavate samudro vācamīṅkhayaḥ |
Translation: 6 Inciter of the voice of song, with thousand streams the ocean flows,

Sanskit Text: सोमः पती रयीणां सखेन्द्रस्य दिवे-दिवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaḥ patī rayīṇāṃ sakhendrasya dive-dive ||
Translation: Even Soma, Lord of opulence, the Friend of Indra, day by day.

Sanskit Text: अयं पूषा रयिर्भगः सोमः पुनानो अर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ pūṣā rayirbhaghaḥ somaḥ punāno arṣati |
Translation: 7 As Pūṣan, Fortune, Bhaga, comes this Soma while they make him pure.

Sanskit Text: पतिर्विश्वस्य भूमनो वयख्यद रोदसी उभे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: patirviśvasya bhūmano vyakhyad rodasī ubhe ||
Translation: He, Lord of the multitude, hath looked upon the earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: समु परिया अनूषत गावो मदाय घर्ष्वयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samu priyā anūṣata ghāvo madāya ghṛṣvayaḥ |
Translation: 8 The dear cows lowed in joyful mood together to the gladdening drink.

Sanskit Text: सोमासः कर्ण्वते पथः पवमानास इन्दवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somāsaḥ kṛṇvate pathaḥ pavamānāsa indavaḥ ||
Translation: The drops as they were purified, the Soma juices, made then paths.

Sanskit Text: य ओजिष्ठस्तमा भर पवमन शरवाय्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya ojiṣṭhastamā bhara pavamana śravāyyam |
Translation: 9 O Pavamana, bring the juice, the mightiest, worthy to be famed,

Sanskit Text: यः पञ्चचर्षणीरभि रयिं येन वनामहै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ pañcacarṣaṇīrabhi rayiṃ yena vanāmahai ||
Translation: Which the Five Tribes have over them, whereby we may win opulence.

Sanskit Text: सोमाः पवन्त इन्दवो.अस्मभ्यं गातुवित्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somāḥ pavanta indavo.asmabhyaṃ ghātuvittamaḥ |
Translation: 10 For us the Soma juices flow, the drops best furtherers of our weal,

Sanskit Text: मित्राः सुवाना अरेपसः सवाध्यः सवर्विदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitrāḥ suvānā arepasaḥ svādhyaḥ svarvidaḥ ||
Translation: Effused as friends without a spot, benevolent, finders of the light.

Sanskit Text: सुष्वाणासो वयद्रिभिश्चिताना गोरधि तवचि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suṣvāṇāso vyadribhiścitānā ghoradhi tvaci |
Translation: 11 Effused by means of pressing-stones, upon the ox-hide visible,

Sanskit Text: इषमस्मभ्यमभितः समस्वरन वसुविदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣamasmabhyamabhitaḥ samasvaran vasuvidaḥ ||
Translation: They, treasure-finders, have announced food unto us from every side.

Sanskit Text: एते पूता विपश्चितः सोमासो दध्याशिरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete pūtā vipaścitaḥ somāso dadhyāśiraḥ |
Translation: 12 Tlese Soma juices, skilled in song, purified, blent with milk and curd,

Sanskit Text: सूर्यासो न दर्शतासो जिगत्नवो धरुवा घर्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūryāso na darśatāso jighatnavo dhruvā ghṛte ||
Translation: When moving and when firmly laid in oil, resemble lovely Suns.

Sanskit Text: पर सुन्वानस्यान्धसो मर्तो न वर्त तद वचः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sunvānasyāndhaso marto na vṛta tad vacaḥ |
Translation: 13 Let not the power of men restrain the voice of the outpouring juice:

Sanskit Text: अप शवानमराधसं हता मखं न भर्गवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa śvānamarādhasaṃ hatā makhaṃ na bhṛghavaḥ ||
Translation: As Bhṛgu's sons chased Makha, so drive ye the greedy hound away.

Sanskit Text: आ जामिरत्के अव्यत भुजे न पुत्र ओण्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā jāmiratke avyata bhuje na putra oṇyoḥ |
Translation: 14 The Friend hath wrapped him in his robe, as in his parents arms, a son.

Sanskit Text: सरज्जारो न योषणां वरो न योनिमासदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarajjāro na yoṣaṇāṃ varo na yonimāsadam ||
Translation: He went, as lover to a dame, to take his station suitor-like.

Sanskit Text: स वीरो दक्षसाधनो वि यस्तस्तम्भ रोदसी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vīro dakṣasādhano vi yastastambha rodasī |
Translation: 15 That Hero who produces strength, he who hath propped both worlds apart,

Sanskit Text: हरिः पवित्रे अव्यत वेधा न योनिमासदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hariḥ pavitre avyata vedhā na yonimāsadam ||
Translation: Gold-hued, hath wrapped him in the sieve, to settle, priest-like, in his place.

Sanskit Text: अव्यो वारेभिः पवते सोमो गव्ये अधि तवचि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avyo vārebhiḥ pavate somo ghavye adhi tvaci |
Translation: 16 Soma upon the ox's skin through the sheep's wool flows purified.

Sanskit Text: कनिक्रदद वर्षा हरिरिन्द्रस्याभ्येति निष्क्र्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kanikradad vṛṣā haririndrasyābhyeti niṣkṛtam ||
Translation: Bellowing out, the Tawny Steer goes on to Indra's special place.

Sanskit Text: कराणा शिशुर्महीनां हिन्वन्न्र्तस्य दीधितिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: krāṇā śiśurmahīnāṃ hinvannṛtasya dīdhitim |
Translation: 1. THE Child, when blended with the streams, speeding the plan of sacrifice,

Sanskit Text: विश्वापरि परिया भुवदध दविता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāpari priyā bhuvadadha dvitā ||
Translation: Surpasses all things that are dear, yea, from of old.

Sanskit Text: उप तरितस्य पाष्योरभक्त यद गुहा पदम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa tritasya pāṣyorabhakta yad ghuhā padam |
Translation: 2 The place, near the two pressing-stones of Trita, hath he occupied,

Sanskit Text: यज्ञस्य सप्त धामभिरध परियम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñasya sapta dhāmabhiradha priyam ||
Translation: Secret and dear through seven lights of sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: तरीणि तरितस्य धारया पर्ष्ठेष्वेरया रयिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trīṇi tritasya dhārayā pṛṣṭheṣverayā rayim |
Translation: 3 Urge to three courses, on the heights of Trita, riches in a stream.

Sanskit Text: मिमीते अस्य योजना वि सुक्रतुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mimīte asya yojanā vi sukratuḥ ||
Translation: He who is passing wise measures his courses out.

Sanskit Text: जज्ञानं सप्त मातरो वेधामशासत शरिये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jajñānaṃ sapta mātaro vedhāmaśāsata śriye |
Translation: 4 Even at his birth the Mothers Seven taught him, for glory, like a sage,

Sanskit Text: अयं धरुवो रयीणां चिकेत यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ dhruvo rayīṇāṃ ciketa yat ||
Translation: So that he, firm and sure, hath set his mind on wealth.

Sanskit Text: अस्य वरते सजोषसो विश्वे देवासो अद्रुहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya vrate sajoṣaso viśve devāso adruhaḥ |
Translation: 5 Under his sway, of one accord, are all the guileless Deities:

Sanskit Text: सपार्हा भवन्ति रन्तयो जुषन्त यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: spārhā bhavanti rantayo juṣanta yat ||
Translation: Warriors to be envied, they, when they are pleased.

Sanskit Text: यमी गर्भं रताव्र्धो दर्शे चारुमजीजनन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamī gharbhaṃ ṛtāvṛdho dṛśe cārumajījanan |
Translation: 6 The Babe whom they who strengthen Law have generated fair to see,

Sanskit Text: कविं मंहिष्ठमध्वरे पुरुस्प्र्हम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaviṃ maṃhiṣṭhamadhvare puruspṛham ||
Translation: Much longed for at the sacrifice, most liberal Sage,—

Sanskit Text: समीचीने अभि तमना यह्वी रतस्य मातरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samīcīne abhi tmanā yahvī ṛtasya mātarā |
Translation: 7 To him, united, of themselves, come the young Parents of the rite,

Sanskit Text: तन्वाना यज्ञमानुषग यदञ्जते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tanvānā yajñamānuṣagh yadañjate ||
Translation: When they adorn him, duly weaving sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: करत्वा शुक्रेभिरक्षभिरणोरप वरजं दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratvā śukrebhirakṣabhirṇorapa vrajaṃ divaḥ |
Translation: 8 With wisdom and with radiant eyes unbar to us the stall of heaven,

Sanskit Text: हिन्वन्न्र्तस्य दीधितिं पराध्वरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hinvannṛtasya dīdhitiṃ prādhvare ||
Translation: Speeding at solemn rite the plan of Holy Law.

Sanskit Text: पर पुनानाय वेधसे सोमाय वच उद्यतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra punānāya vedhase somāya vaca udyatam |
Translation: 1. To Soma who is purified as ordering Priest the song is raised:

Sanskit Text: भर्तिं न भरा मतिभिर्जुजोषते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhṛtiṃ na bharā matibhirjujoṣate ||
Translation: Bring meed, as ’twere, to one who makes thee glad with hymns.

Sanskit Text: परि वाराण्यव्यया गोभिरञ्जानो अर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari vārāṇyavyayā ghobhirañjāno arṣati |
Translation: 2 Blended with milk and curds he flows on through the long wool of the sheep.

Sanskit Text: तरी षधस्था पुनानः कर्णुते हरिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trī ṣadhasthā punānaḥ kṛṇute hariḥ ||
Translation: The Gold-hued, purified, makes him three seats for rest.

Sanskit Text: परि कोशं मधुश्चुतमव्यये वारे अर्षति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari kośaṃ madhuścutamavyaye vāre arṣati |
Translation: 3 On through the long wool of the sheep to the meath-dropping vat he flows:

Sanskit Text: अभि वाणीरषीणां सप्त नूषत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi vāṇīrṣīṇāṃ sapta nūṣata ||
Translation: The Ṛṣis’ sevenfold quire hath sung aloud to him.

Sanskit Text: परि णेता मतीनां विश्वदेवो अदाभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari ṇetā matīnāṃ viśvadevo adābhyaḥ |
Translation: 4 Shared by all Gods, Infallible, the Leader of our holy hymns,

Sanskit Text: सोमः पुनानश्चम्वोर्विशद धरिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaḥ punānaścamvorviśad dhariḥ ||
Translation: Golden-hued Soma, being cleansed, hath reached the bowls.

Sanskit Text: परि दैवीरनु सवधा इन्द्रेण याहि सरथम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari daivīranu svadhā indreṇa yāhi saratham |
Translation: 5 After thy Godlike qualities, associate with Indra, go,

Sanskit Text: पुनानो वाघद वाघद्भिरमर्त्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punāno vāghad vāghadbhiramartyaḥ ||
Translation: As a Priest purified by priests, Immortal One.

Sanskit Text: परि सप्तिर्न वाजयुर्देवो देवेभ्यः सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari saptirna vājayurdevo devebhyaḥ sutaḥ |
Translation: 6 Like a car-horse who shows his strength, a God effused for Deities.

Sanskit Text: वयानशिः पवमानो वि धावति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyānaśiḥ pavamāno vi dhāvati ||
Translation: The penetrating Pavamana flows along.

Sanskit Text: सखाय आ नि शीदत पुनानाय पर गायत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhāya ā ni śīdata punānāya pra ghāyata |
Translation: 1. SIT down, O friends, and sing aloud to him who purifies himself:

Sanskit Text: शिशुं न यज्ञैः परि भूषत शरिये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śiśuṃ na yajñaiḥ pari bhūṣata śriye ||
Translation: Deck him for glory, like a child, with holy rites.

Sanskit Text: समी वत्सं न मात्र्भिः सर्जता गयसाधनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samī vatsaṃ na mātṛbhiḥ sṛjatā ghayasādhanam |
Translation: 2 Unite him bringing household wealth, even as a calf, with mother kine,

Sanskit Text: देवाव्यम्मदमभि दविशवसम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāvyammadamabhi dviśavasam ||
Translation: Him who hath double strength, the God, delighting juice.

Sanskit Text: पुनाता दक्षसाधनं यथा शर्धाय वीतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: punātā dakṣasādhanaṃ yathā śardhāya vītaye |
Translation: 3 Purify him who gives us power, that he, most Blessed One, may be

Sanskit Text: यथा मित्राय वरुणाय शन्तमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā mitrāya varuṇāya śantamaḥ ||
Translation: A banquet for the Troop, Mitra, and Varuṇa.

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं तवा वसुविदमभि वाणीरनूषत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ tvā vasuvidamabhi vāṇīranūṣata |
Translation: 4 Voices have sung aloud to thee as finderout of wealth for us:

Sanskit Text: गोभिष टे वर्णमभि वासयामसि ||
