Sanskrit Transliteration: ghobhiṣ ṭe varṇamabhi vāsayāmasi ||
Translation: We clothe the hue thou wearest with a robe of milk.

Sanskit Text: स नो मदानां पत इन्दो देवप्सरा असि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no madānāṃ pata indo devapsarā asi |
Translation: 5 Thou, Indu, art the food of Gods, O Sovran of all gladdening drinks:

Sanskit Text: सखेव सख्ये गातुवित्तमो भव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakheva sakhye ghātuvittamo bhava ||
Translation: As Friend for friend, be thou best finder of success.

Sanskit Text: सनेमि कर्ध्यस्मदा रक्षसं कं चिदत्रिणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanemi kṛdhyasmadā rakṣasaṃ kaṃ cidatriṇam |
Translation: 6 Drive utterly away from us each demon, each voracious fiend,

Sanskit Text: अपादेवं दवयुमंहो युयोधि नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apādevaṃ dvayumaṃho yuyodhi naḥ ||
Translation: The godless and the false: keep sorrow far away.

Sanskit Text: तं वः सखायो मदाय पुनानमभि गायत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vaḥ sakhāyo madāya punānamabhi ghāyata |
Translation: 1. SING; ye aloud, O friends, to him who makes him pure for gladdening drink:

Sanskit Text: शिशुं न यज्ञैः सवदयन्त गूर्तिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śiśuṃ na yajñaiḥ svadayanta ghūrtibhiḥ ||
Translation: They shall make sweet the Child with sacrifice and laud.

Sanskit Text: सं वत्स इव मात्र्भिरिन्दुर्हिन्वानो अज्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ vatsa iva mātṛbhirindurhinvāno ajyate |
Translation: 2 Like as a calf with mother cows, so Indu is urged forth and sent,

Sanskit Text: देवावीर्मदोमतिभिः परिष्क्र्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāvīrmadomatibhiḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ ||
Translation: Glorified by our hymns, the God-delighting juice.

Sanskit Text: अयं दक्षाय साधनो.अयं शर्धाय वीतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ dakṣāya sādhano.ayaṃ śardhāya vītaye |
Translation: 3 Effectual means of power is he, he is a banquet for the Troop,

Sanskit Text: अयं देवेभ्यो मधुमत्तमः सुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ devebhyo madhumattamaḥ sutaḥ ||
Translation: He who hath been effused, most rich in meath, for Gods.

Sanskit Text: गोमन न इन्दो अश्ववत सुतः सुदक्ष धन्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghoman na indo aśvavat sutaḥ sudakṣa dhanva |
Translation: 4 Flow to us, Indu, passing, strong, effused, with wealth of kine and steeds:

Sanskit Text: शुचिं ते वर्णमधि गोषु दीधरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuciṃ te varṇamadhi ghoṣu dīdharam ||
Translation: I will spread forth above the milk thy radiant hue.

Sanskit Text: स नो हरीणां पत इन्दो देवप्सरस्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no harīṇāṃ pata indo devapsarastamaḥ |
Translation: 5 Lord of the tawny, Indu thou who art the God's most special food,

Sanskit Text: सखेव सख्ये नर्यो रुचे भव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakheva sakhye naryo ruce bhava ||
Translation: As Friend to friend, for splendour be thou good to men.

Sanskit Text: सनेमि तवमस्मदानदेवं कं चिदत्रिणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanemi tvamasmadānadevaṃ kaṃ cidatriṇam |
Translation: 6 Drive utterly, far away from us each godless, each voracious foe.

Sanskit Text: साह्वानिन्दो परि बाधो अप दवयुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sāhvānindo pari bādho apa dvayum ||
Translation: O Indu, overcome and drive the false afar.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रमछ सुता इमे वर्षणं यन्तु हरयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indramacha sutā ime vṛṣaṇaṃ yantu harayaḥ |
Translation: 1. To Indra, to the Mighty Steer, may these gold-coloured juices go,

Sanskit Text: शरुष्टी जातास इन्दवः सवर्विदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śruṣṭī jātāsa indavaḥ svarvidaḥ ||
Translation: Drops rapidly produced, that find the light of heaven.

Sanskit Text: अयं भराय सानसिरिन्द्राय पवते सुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ bharāya sānasirindrāya pavate sutaḥ |
Translation: 2 Effused, this juice victorious flows for Indra, for his maintenance.

Sanskit Text: सोमो जैत्रस्यचेतति यथा विदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somo jaitrasyacetati yathā vide ||
Translation: Soma bethinks him of the Conqueror, as he knows.

Sanskit Text: अस्येदिन्द्रो मदेष्वा गराभं गर्भ्णीत सानसिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asyedindro madeṣvā ghrābhaṃ ghṛbhṇīta sānasim |
Translation: 3 May Indra in his raptures gain from him the grasp that gathers spoil,

Sanskit Text: वज्रंच वर्षणं भरत समप्सुजित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vajraṃca vṛṣaṇaṃ bharat samapsujit ||
Translation: And, winning waters, wield the steerstrong thunderbolt.

Sanskit Text: पर धन्वा सोम जाग्र्विरिन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra dhanvā soma jāghṛvirindrāyendo pari srava |
Translation: 4 Flow vigilant for Indra, thou Soma, yea, Indu, run thou on:

Sanskit Text: दयुमन्तं शुष्ममा भरा सवर्विदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyumantaṃ śuṣmamā bharā svarvidam ||
Translation: Bring hither splendid strength that finds the light of heaven.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय वर्षणं मदं पवस्व विश्वदर्शतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya vṛṣaṇaṃ madaṃ pavasva viśvadarśataḥ |
Translation: 5 Do thou, all-beautiful, purify for Indra's sake the mighty juice,

Sanskit Text: सहस्रयामा पथिक्र्द विचक्षणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasrayāmā pathikṛd vicakṣaṇaḥ ||
Translation: Path-maker thou, far seeing, with a thousand ways.

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं गातुवित्तमो देवेभ्यो मधुमत्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ ghātuvittamo devebhyo madhumattamaḥ |
Translation: 6 Best finder of prosperity for us, most rich in sweets for Gods,

Sanskit Text: सहस्रं याहिपथिभिः कनिक्रदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasraṃ yāhipathibhiḥ kanikradat ||
Translation: Proceed thou loudly roaring on a thousand paths.

Sanskit Text: पवस्व देववीतय इन्दो धाराभिरोजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva devavītaya indo dhārābhirojasā |
Translation: 7 O Indu, with thy streams, in might, flow for the banquet of the Gods:

Sanskit Text: आ कलशं मधुमान सोम नः सदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā kalaśaṃ madhumān soma naḥ sadaḥ ||
Translation: Rich in meath, Soma, in our beaker take thy place.

Sanskit Text: तव दरप्सा उदप्रुत इन्द्रं मदाय वाव्र्धुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava drapsā udapruta indraṃ madāya vāvṛdhuḥ |
Translation: 8 Thy drops that swim in water have exalted Indra to delight:

Sanskit Text: तवां देवासो अम्र्ताय कं पपुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ devāso amṛtāya kaṃ papuḥ ||
Translation: The Gods have drunk thee up for immortality.

Sanskit Text: आ नः सुतास इन्दवः पुनाना धावता रयिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā naḥ sutāsa indavaḥ punānā dhāvatā rayim |
Translation: 9 Stream opulence to us, ye drops of Soma, pressed and purified,

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्टिद्यावोरीत्यापः सवर्विदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṭidyāvorītyāpaḥ svarvidaḥ ||
Translation: Pouring down rain from heaven in hoods, and finding light.

Sanskit Text: सोमः पुनान ऊर्मिणाव्यो वारं वि धावति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaḥ punāna ūrmiṇāvyo vāraṃ vi dhāvati |
Translation: 10 Soma, while filtered, with his wave flows through the long wool of the sheep,

Sanskit Text: अग्रे वाचःपवमानः कनिक्रदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghre vācaḥpavamānaḥ kanikradat ||
Translation: Shouting while purified before the voice of song.

Sanskit Text: धीभिर्हिन्वन्ति वाजिनं वने करीळन्तमत्यविम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhībhirhinvanti vājinaṃ vane krīḷantamatyavim |
Translation: 11 With songs they send the Mighty forth, sporting in wood, above the fleece:

Sanskit Text: अभि तरिप्र्ष्ठं मतयः समस्वरन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tripṛṣṭhaṃ matayaḥ samasvaran ||
Translation: Our psalms have glorified him of the triple height.

Sanskit Text: असर्जि कलशानभि मीळ्हे सप्तिर्न वाजयुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asarji kalaśānabhi mīḷhe saptirna vājayuḥ |
Translation: 12 Into the jars hath he been loosed, like an impetuous steed for war,

Sanskit Text: पुनानो वाचं जनयन्नसिष्यदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punāno vācaṃ janayannasiṣyadat ||
Translation: And lifting up his voice, while filtered, glided on.

Sanskit Text: पवते हर्यतो हरिरति हवरांसि रंह्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavate haryato harirati hvarāṃsi raṃhyā |
Translation: 13 Gold-hued and lovely in his course, througb tangles of the wool he flows,

Sanskit Text: अभ्यर्षन सतोत्र्भ्यो वीरवद यशः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhyarṣan stotṛbhyo vīravad yaśaḥ ||
Translation: And pours heroic fame upon the worshippers.

Sanskit Text: अया पवस्व देवयुर्मधोर्धारा अस्र्क्षत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayā pavasva devayurmadhordhārā asṛkṣata |
Translation: 14 Flow thus, a faithful votary: the streams of meath have been effused.

Sanskit Text: रेभन पवित्रम्पर्येषि विश्वतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rebhan pavitramparyeṣi viśvataḥ ||
Translation: Thou comest to the filter, singing, from each side.

Sanskit Text: पवस्व मधुमत्तम इन्द्राय सोम करतुवित्तमो मदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva madhumattama indrāya soma kratuvittamo madaḥ |
Translation: 1. FOR Indra, flow thou Soma on, as gladdening juice most sweet, intelligent,

Sanskit Text: महि दयुक्षतमो मदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahi dyukṣatamo madaḥ ||
Translation: Great, cheering, dwelling most in heaven.

Sanskit Text: यस्य ते पीत्वा वर्षभो वर्षायते.अस्य पीता सवर्विदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya te pītvā vṛṣabho vṛṣāyate.asya pītā svarvidaḥ |
Translation: 2 Thou, of whom having drunk the Steer acts like a steer. drinking of this that finds the light,

Sanskit Text: स सुप्रकेतो अभ्यक्रमीदिशो.अछा वाजं नैतशः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa supraketo abhyakramīdiśo.achā vājaṃ naitaśaḥ ||
Translation: He, Excellently Wise, is come to strengthening food, to spoil and wealth like Etaśa.

Sanskit Text: तवं हयन्ग दैव्या पवमान जनिमानि दयुमत्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hyangha daivyā pavamāna janimāni dyumattamaḥ |
Translation: 3 For, verily, Pavamana, thou hast, splendidest, called all the generations of

Sanskit Text: अम्र्तत्वाय घोषयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: amṛtatvāya ghoṣayaḥ ||
Translation: The Gods to immortality.

Sanskit Text: येना नवग्वो दध्यन्नपोर्णुते येन विप्रास आपिरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenā navaghvo dadhyannaporṇute yena viprāsa āpire |
Translation: 4 By whom Dadhyac Navagva opens fastened doors, by whom the sages gained their wish,

Sanskit Text: देवानां सुम्ने अम्र्तस्य चारुणो येन शरवांस्यानशुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānāṃ sumne amṛtasya cāruṇo yena śravāṃsyānaśuḥ ||
Translation: By whom they won the fame of lovely Amṛta in the felicity of Gods.

Sanskit Text: एष सय धारया सुतो.अव्यो वारेभिः पवते मदिन्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa sya dhārayā suto.avyo vārebhiḥ pavate madintamaḥ |
Translation: 5 Effused, he floweth in a stream, best rapture-giver, in the long wool of the sheep,

Sanskit Text: करीळन्नूर्मिरपामिव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: krīḷannūrmirapāmiva ||
Translation: Sporting, as ’twere the waters' wave.

Sanskit Text: य उस्रिया अप्या अन्तरश्मनो निर्गा अक्र्न्तदोजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya usriyā apyā antaraśmano nirghā akṛntadojasā |
Translation: 6 He who from out the rocky cavern took with might the redmrefulgent watery Cows,

Sanskit Text: अभिव्रजं तत्निषे गव्यमश्व्यं वर्मीव धर्ष्णवा रुज ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhivrajaṃ tatniṣe ghavyamaśvyaṃ varmīva dhṛṣṇavā ruja ||
Translation: Thou masterest the stable full of kine and steeds: burst it, brave Lord, like one in mail.

Sanskit Text: आ सोता परि षिञ्चताश्वं न सतोममप्तुरं रजस्तुरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā sotā pari ṣiñcatāśvaṃ na stomamapturaṃ rajasturam |
Translation: 7 Press ye and pour him, like a steed, laudworthy, speeding through the region and the flood,

Sanskit Text: वनर्क्षमुदप्रुतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanaṛkṣamudaprutam ||
Translation: Who swims in water, roan in wood;

Sanskit Text: सहस्रधारं वर्षभं पयोव्र्धं परियं देवाय जन्मने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasradhāraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ payovṛdhaṃ priyaṃ devāya janmane |
Translation: 8 Increaser of the water, Steer with thousand streams, dear to the race of Deities;

Sanskit Text: रतेन य रतजातो विवाव्र्धे राजा देव रतं बर्हत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtena ya ṛtajāto vivāvṛdhe rājā deva ṛtaṃ bṛhat ||
Translation: Who born in Law hath waxen mighty by the Law, King, God, and lofty Ordinance.

Sanskit Text: अभि दयुम्नं बर्हद यश इषस पते दिदीहि देव देवयुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi dyumnaṃ bṛhad yaśa iṣas pate didīhi deva devayuḥ |
Translation: 9 Make splendid glory shine on us, thou Lord of strengthening food, God, as the Friend of Gods:

Sanskit Text: विकोशं मध्यमं युव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vikośaṃ madhyamaṃ yuva ||
Translation: Unclose the fount of middle air.

Sanskit Text: आ वच्यस्व सुदक्ष चम्वोः सुतो विशां वह्निर्न विश्पतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vacyasva sudakṣa camvoḥ suto viśāṃ vahnirna viśpatiḥ |
Translation: 10 Roll onward to the bowls, O Mighty One, effused, as Prince supporter of the tribes.

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्टिं दिवः पवस्व रीतिमपां जिन्वा गविष्टये धियः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṭiṃ divaḥ pavasva rītimapāṃ jinvā ghaviṣṭaye dhiyaḥ ||
Translation: Pour on us rain from heaven, send us the waters' flow: incite our thoughts to win the spoil.

Sanskit Text: एतमु तयं मदच्युतं सहस्रधारं वर्षभं दिवो दुहुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etamu tyaṃ madacyutaṃ sahasradhāraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ divo duhuḥ |
Translation: 11 They have drained him the Steer of heaven, him with a thousand streams, distilling rapturous joy,

Sanskit Text: विश्वा वसूनि बिभ्रतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā vasūni bibhratam ||
Translation: Him who brings all things excellent.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा वि जज्ञे जनयन्नमर्त्यः परतपञ जयोतिषा तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā vi jajñe janayannamartyaḥ pratapañ jyotiṣā tamaḥ |
Translation: 12 The Mighty One was born Immortal, giving life, lightening darkness with his shine.

Sanskit Text: स सुष्टुतः कविभिर्निर्णिजं दधे तरिधात्वस्य दंससा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa suṣṭutaḥ kavibhirnirṇijaṃ dadhe tridhātvasya daṃsasā ||
Translation: Wcll-praised by. sages he hath. by his wondrous power assumed the Threefold as his robe.

Sanskit Text: स सुन्वे यो वसूनां यो रायामानेता य इळानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sunve yo vasūnāṃ yo rāyāmānetā ya iḷānām |
Translation: 13 Effused is he who brings good things, who brings us bounteous gifts and sweet refreshing food,

Sanskit Text: सोमोयः सुक्षितीनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somoyaḥ sukṣitīnām ||
Translation: Soma who brings us quiet homes:

Sanskit Text: यस्य न इन्द्रः पिबाद यस्य मरुतो यस्य वार्यमणा भगः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya na indraḥ pibād yasya maruto yasya vāryamaṇā bhaghaḥ |
Translation: 14 He whom our Indra and the Marut host shall drink, Bhaga shall drink with Aryarnan,

Sanskit Text: आ येन मित्रावरुणा करामह एन्द्रमवसे महे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yena mitrāvaruṇā karāmaha endramavase mahe ||
Translation: By whom we bring to us Mitra and Varuṇa and Indra for our great defence.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राय सोम पातवे नर्भिर्यतः सवायुधो मदिन्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāya soma pātave nṛbhiryataḥ svāyudho madintamaḥ |
Translation: 15 Soma, for Indra's drink do thou, led by the men, well-wcaponcd and most gladdening,

Sanskit Text: पवस्व मधुमत्तमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva madhumattamaḥ ||
Translation: Flow on with greatest store of sweets.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य हार्दि सोमधानमा विश समुद्रमिव सिन्धवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya hārdi somadhānamā viśa samudramiva sindhavaḥ |
Translation: 16 Enter the Soma-holder, even Indra's heart, as rivers pass into the sea,

Sanskit Text: जुष्टो मित्राय वरुणाय वायवे दिवो विष्टम्भ उत्तमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣṭo mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave divo viṣṭambha uttamaḥ ||
Translation: Acceptable to Mitra, Vāyu, Varuṇa, the noblest Pillar of the heavens.

Sanskit Text: परि पर धन्वेन्द्राय सोम सवादुर मित्राय पूष्णे भगाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari pra dhanvendrāya soma svādur mitrāya pūṣṇe bhaghāya ||
Translation: 1. PLEASANT to Indra's Mitra's, Pūṣan's Bhaga's taste, sped onward, Soma, with thy flowing stream.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस ते सोम सुतस्य पेयाः करत्वे दक्षाय विश्वे च देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indras te soma sutasya peyāḥ kratve dakṣāya viśve ca devāḥ ||
Translation: 2 Let Indra drink, O Soma, of thy juice for wisdom, and all Deities for strength.

Sanskit Text: एवाम्र्ताय महे कषयाय स शुक्रो अर्ष दिव्यः पीयूषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evāmṛtāya mahe kṣayāya sa śukro arṣa divyaḥ pīyūṣaḥ ||
Translation: 3 So flow thou on as bright celestial juice, flow to the vast, immortal dwelling-place.

Sanskit Text: पवस्व सोम महान समुद्रः पिता देवानां विश्वाभि धाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva soma mahān samudraḥ pitā devānāṃ viśvābhi dhāma ||
Translation: 4 Flow onward, Soma, as a mighty sea, as Father of the Gods to every form.

Sanskit Text: शुक्रः पवस्व देवेभ्यः सोम दिवे पर्थिव्यै शं च परजायै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śukraḥ pavasva devebhyaḥ soma dive pṛthivyai śaṃ ca prajāyai ||
Translation: 5 Flow on, O Soma, radiant for the Gods and Heaven and Earth and bless our progeny.

Sanskit Text: दिवो धर्तासि शुक्रः पीयूषः सत्ये विधर्मन वाजी पवस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo dhartāsi śukraḥ pīyūṣaḥ satye vidharman vājī pavasva ||
Translation: 6 Thou, bright Juice, art Sustainer of the sky: flow, mighty, in accordance with true Law.

Sanskit Text: पवस्व सोम दयुम्नी सुधारो महाम अवीनाम अनु पूर्व्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva soma dyumnī sudhāro mahām avīnām anu pūrvyaḥ ||
Translation: 7 Soma, flow splendid with thy copious stream through the great fleece as in the olden time.

Sanskit Text: नर्भिर येमानो जज्ञानः पूतः कषरद विश्वानि मन्द्रः सवर्वित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛbhir yemāno jajñānaḥ pūtaḥ kṣarad viśvāni mandraḥ svarvit ||
Translation: 8 Bom, led by men, joyous, and purified, let the Light-finder make all blessings flow:

Sanskit Text: इन्दुः पुनानः परजाम उराणः करद विश्वानि दरविणानि नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: induḥ punānaḥ prajām urāṇaḥ karad viśvāni draviṇāni naḥ ||
Translation: 9 Indu, while cleansed, keeping the people safe, shall give us all possessions for our own.

Sanskit Text: पवस्व सोम करत्वे दक्षायाश्वो न निक्तो वाजी धनाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pavasva soma kratve dakṣāyāśvo na nikto vājī dhanāya ||
Translation: 10 Flow on for wisdom, Soma, and for power, as a strong courser bathed, to win the prize.

Sanskit Text: तं ते सोतारो रसम मदाय पुनन्ति सोमम महे दयुम्नाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ te sotāro rasam madāya punanti somam mahe dyumnāya ||
Translation: 11 The pressers purify this juice of thine, the Soma, for delight, and lofty fame

Sanskit Text: शिशुं जज्ञानं हरिम मर्जन्ति पवित्रे सोमं देवेभ्य इन्दुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śiśuṃ jajñānaṃ harim mṛjanti pavitre somaṃ devebhya indum ||
Translation: 12 They deck the Gold-hued Infant, newlyborn, even Soma, Indu, in the sieve for Gods.

Sanskit Text: इन्दुः पविष्ट चारुर मदायापाम उपस्थे कविर भगाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: induḥ paviṣṭa cārur madāyāpām upasthe kavir bhaghāya ||
Translation: 13 Fair Indu hath flowed on for rapturous joy, Sage for good fortune in the waters' lap.

Sanskit Text: बिभर्ति चार्व इन्द्रस्य नाम येन विश्वानि वर्त्रा जघान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bibharti cārv indrasya nāma yena viśvāni vṛtrā jaghāna ||
Translation: 14 He bears the beauteous name of Indra, that wherewith he overcame all demon foes.

Sanskit Text: पिबन्त्य अस्य विश्वे देवासो गोभिः शरीतस्य नर्भिः सुतस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibanty asya viśve devāso ghobhiḥ śrītasya nṛbhiḥ sutasya ||
Translation: 15 All Deities are wont to drink of him, pressed by the men and blent with milk and curds.

Sanskit Text: पर सुवानो अक्षाः सहस्रधारस तिरः पवित्रं वि वारम अव्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra suvāno akṣāḥ sahasradhāras tiraḥ pavitraṃ vi vāram avyam ||
Translation: 16 He hath flowed forth with thousand streams effused, flowed ihsough the filter and the sheep's long wool.

Sanskit Text: स वाज्य अक्षाः सहस्ररेता अद्भिर मर्जानो गोभिः शरीणानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vājy akṣāḥ sahasraretā adbhir mṛjāno ghobhiḥ śrīṇānaḥ ||
Translation: 17 With endless genial flow the Strong hath run, purified by the waters, blent with milk.

Sanskit Text: पर सोम याहीन्द्रस्य कुक्षा नर्भिर येमानो अद्रिभिः सुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra soma yāhīndrasya kukṣā nṛbhir yemāno adribhiḥ sutaḥ ||
Translation: 18 Pressed out with stones, directed by the men, go fortli, O Soma, into Indra's throat.

Sanskit Text: असर्जि वाजी तिरः पवित्रम इन्द्राय सोमः सहस्रधारः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asarji vājī tiraḥ pavitram indrāya somaḥ sahasradhāraḥ ||
Translation: 19 The mighty Soma with a thousand streams is poured to Indra through the cleansing sieve.

Sanskit Text: अञ्जन्त्य एनम मध्वो रसेनेन्द्राय वर्ष्ण इन्दुम मदाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: añjanty enam madhvo rasenendrāya vṛṣṇa indum madāya ||
Translation: 20 Indu they balm with pleasant milky juice for Indra, for the Steer, for his delight.

Sanskit Text: देवेभ्यस तवा वर्था पाजसे ऽपो वसानं हरिम मर्जन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devebhyas tvā vṛthā pājase 'po vasānaṃ harim mṛjanti ||
Translation: 21 Lightly, for sheen, they cleanse thee for the Gods, gold-coloured, wearing water as thy robe.

Sanskit Text: इन्दुर इन्द्राय तोशते नि तोशते शरीणन्न उग्रो रिणन्न अपः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indur indrāya tośate ni tośate śrīṇann ughro riṇann apaḥ ||
Translation: 22 Indu to Indra streams, yea, downward streams, Strong, flowing to the floods, and mingling -there.

Sanskit Text: पर्यू षु पर धन्व वाजसातये परि वर्त्राणि सक्षणिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: paryū ṣu pra dhanva vājasātaye pari vṛtrāṇi sakṣaṇiḥ |
Translation: 1. O'ERPOWERING Vṛtras, forward run to win great strength:

Sanskit Text: दविषस्तरध्या रणया न ईयसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dviṣastaradhyā ṛṇayā na īyase ||
Translation: Thou speedest to subdue like one exacting debts.

Sanskit Text: अनु हि तवा सुतं सोम मदामसि महे समर्यराज्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu hi tvā sutaṃ soma madāmasi mahe samaryarājye |
Translation: 2 In thee, effused, O Soma, we rejoice ourselves for great supremacy in fight.

Sanskit Text: वाजानभि पवमान पर गाहसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājānabhi pavamāna pra ghāhase ||
Translation: Thou, Pavamana, enterest into mighty deeds,

Sanskit Text: अजीजनो हि पवमान सूर्यं विधारे शक्मना पयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajījano hi pavamāna sūryaṃ vidhāre śakmanā payaḥ |
Translation: 3 O Pavamana, thou didst generate the Sun, and spread the moisture out with power,

Sanskit Text: गोजीरया रंहमानः पुरन्ध्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghojīrayā raṃhamānaḥ purandhyā ||
Translation: Hasting to us with plenty vivified with milk.

Sanskit Text: अजीजनो अम्र्त मर्त्येष्वा रतस्य धर्मन्नम्र्तस्य चारुणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajījano amṛta martyeṣvā ṛtasya dharmannamṛtasya cāruṇaḥ |
Translation: 4 Thou didst produce him, Deathless God mid mortal men for maintenance of Law and lovely Amṛta:

Sanskit Text: सदासरो वाजमछा सनिष्यदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadāsaro vājamachā saniṣyadat ||
Translation: Thou evermore hast moved making strength flow to us.

Sanskit Text: अभ्य-अभि हि शरवसा ततर्दिथोत्सं न कं चिज्जनपानमक्षितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhy-abhi hi śravasā tatardithotsaṃ na kaṃ cijjanapānamakṣitam |
Translation: 5 All round about hast thou with glory pierced for us as ’twere a never-failing well for men to drink,

Sanskit Text: शर्याभिर्न भरमाणो गभस्त्योः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaryābhirna bharamāṇo ghabhastyoḥ ||
Translation: Borne on thy way in fragments from the presser's arms.

Sanskit Text: आदीं के चित पश्यमानास आप्यं वसुरुचो दिव्या अभ्यनूषत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādīṃ ke cit paśyamānāsa āpyaṃ vasuruco divyā abhyanūṣata |
Translation: 6 Then, beautifully radiant, certain Heavenly Ones, have sung to him their kinship as they looked thereon,

Sanskit Text: वारं न देवः सविता वयूर्णुते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāraṃ na devaḥ savitā vyūrṇute ||
Translation: And Savitar the God opens as ’twere a stall.

Sanskit Text: तवे सोम परथमा वर्क्तबर्हिषो महे वाजाय शरवसे धियन्दधुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve soma prathamā vṛktabarhiṣo mahe vājāya śravase dhiyandadhuḥ |
Translation: 7 Soma, the men of old whose grass was trimmed addressed the hymn to thee for mighty strength and for renown:

Sanskit Text: स तवं नो वीर वीर्याय चोदय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvaṃ no vīra vīryāya codaya ||
Translation: So, Hero, urge us onward to heroic power.

Sanskit Text: दिवः पीयूषं पूर्व्यं यदुक्थ्यं महो गाहाद दिव आनिरधुक्षत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divaḥ pīyūṣaṃ pūrvyaṃ yadukthyaṃ maho ghāhād diva āniradhukṣata |
Translation: 8 They have drained forth from out the great depth of the sky the old primeval milk of heaven that claims the laud:

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रमभि जायमानं समस्वरन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indramabhi jāyamānaṃ samasvaran ||
Translation: They lifted up their voice to Indra athis birth.

Sanskit Text: अध यदिमे पवमान रोदसी इमा च विश्वा भुवनाभि मज्मना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha yadime pavamāna rodasī imā ca viśvā bhuvanābhi majmanā |
Translation: 9 As long as thou, O Pavamana, art above this earth and heaven and all existence in thy might,

Sanskit Text: यूथे न निष्ठा वर्षभो वि तिष्ठसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūthe na niṣṭhā vṛṣabho vi tiṣṭhase ||
Translation: Thou standest like a Bull the chief amid the herd.

Sanskit Text: सोमः पुनानो अव्यये वारे शिशुर्न करीळन पवमानो अक्षाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaḥ punāno avyaye vāre śiśurna krīḷan pavamāno akṣāḥ |
Translation: 10 In the sheep's wool hath Soma Pavamana flowed, while they cleanse him, like a playful infant,

Sanskit Text: सहस्रधारः शतवाज इन्दुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasradhāraḥ śatavāja induḥ ||
Translation: Indu with hundred powers and hundred currents.

Sanskit Text: एष पुनानो मधुमान रतावेन्द्रायेन्दुः पवते सवादुरूर्मिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa punāno madhumān ṛtāvendrāyenduḥ pavate svādurūrmiḥ |
Translation: 11 Holy and sweet, while purified, this Indu flows on, a wave of pleasant taste, to Indra,—

Sanskit Text: वाजसनिर्वरिवोविद वयोधाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājasanirvarivovid vayodhāḥ ||
Translation: Strength-winner, Treasure-finder, Life. bestower.

Sanskit Text: स पवस्व सहमानः पर्तन्यून सेधन रक्षांस्यप दुर्गहाणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pavasva sahamānaḥ pṛtanyūn sedhan rakṣāṃsyapa durghahāṇi |
Translation: 12 So flow thou on, subduing our assailants, chasing the demons hard to beencountered,

Sanskit Text: सवायुधः सासह्वान सोम शत्रून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāyudhaḥ sāsahvān soma śatrūn ||
Translation: Well-armed and conquering our foes, O Soma.

Sanskit Text: अया रुचा हरिण्या पुनानो विश्वा दवेषांसि तरति सवयुग्वभिः सूरो न सवयुग्वभिः | धारा सुतस्य रोचते पुनानो अरुषो हरिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayā rucā hariṇyā punāno viśvā dveṣāṃsi tarati svayughvabhiḥ sūro na svayughvabhiḥ | dhārā sutasya rocate punāno aruṣo hariḥ |
Translation: 1. WITH this his golden splendour purifying him, he with his own allies subdues all enemies, as Sara with his own allies.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा यद रूपा परियात्य रक्वभिः सप्तास्येभिरकवभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā yad rūpā pariyāty ṛkvabhiḥ saptāsyebhirkvabhiḥ ||
Translation: Cleansing himself with stream of juice he shines forth yellow-hued and red, when with the praisers he encompasses all forms, with praisers having seven mouths.

Sanskit Text: तवं तयत पणीनां विदो वसु सं मात्र्भिर्मर्जयसि सव आ दम रतस्य धीतिभिर्दमे | परावतो न साम तद यत्रारणन्ति धीतयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tyat paṇīnāṃ vido vasu saṃ mātṛbhirmarjayasi sva ā dama ṛtasya dhītibhirdame | parāvato na sāma tad yatrāraṇanti dhītayaḥ |
Translation: 2 That treasure of the Paṇis thou discoveredst; thou with thy mothers deckest thee in thine abode, with songs of worship in thine home.

Sanskit Text: तरिधातुभिररुषीभिर्वयो दधे रोचमानो वयो दधे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tridhātubhiraruṣībhirvayo dadhe rocamāno vayo dadhe ||
Translation: As ’twere from far, the hymn is heard, where holy songs resound in joy. He with the ruddy-hued, threefold hath won life-power, he, glittering, hath won life-power.

Sanskit Text: पूर्वामनु परदिशं याति चेकितत सं रश्मिभिर्यतते दर्शतो रथो दैव्यो दर्शतो रथः | अग्मन्नुक्थानि पौंस्येन्द्रं जैत्राय हर्षयन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvāmanu pradiśaṃ yāti cekitat saṃ raśmibhiryatate darśato ratho daivyo darśato rathaḥ | aghmannukthāni pauṃsyendraṃ jaitrāya harṣayan |
Translation: 3 He moves intelligent, directed to the East. The very beauteous car rivals the beams of light, the beautiful celestial car.

Sanskit Text: वज्रश्च यद भवथो अनपच्युतासमत्स्वनपच्युता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vajraśca yad bhavatho anapacyutāsamatsvanapacyutā ||
Translation: Hymns, lauding manly valour, came, inciting Indra to success, that ye may be unconquered, both thy bolt and thou, both be unconquered in the war.

Sanskit Text: नानानं वा उ नो धियो वि वरतानि जनानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nānānaṃ vā u no dhiyo vi vratāni janānām |
Translation: 1. WE all have various thoughts and plans, and diverse are the ways of men.

Sanskit Text: तक्षा रिष्टं रुतं भिषग बरह्मा सुन्वन्तमिछतीन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: takṣā riṣṭaṃ rutaṃ bhiṣagh brahmā sunvantamichatīndrāyendo pari srava ||
Translation: The Brahman seeks the worshipper, wright seeks the cracked, and leech the maimed. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

Sanskit Text: जरतीभिरोषधीभिः पर्णेभिः शकुनानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jaratībhiroṣadhībhiḥ parṇebhiḥ śakunānām |
Translation: 2 The smith with ripe and seasoned plants, with feathers of the birds of air,

Sanskit Text: कार्मारो अश्मभिर्द्युभिर्हिरण्यवन्तमिछतीन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kārmāro aśmabhirdyubhirhiraṇyavantamichatīndrāyendo pari srava ||
Translation: With stones, and with enkindled flames, seeks him who hath a store of gold. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

Sanskit Text: कारुरहं ततो भिषगुपलप्रक्षिणी नना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kārurahaṃ tato bhiṣaghupalaprakṣiṇī nanā |
Translation: 3 A bard am I, my dad's a leech, mammy lays corn upon the stones.

Sanskit Text: नानाधियोवसूयवो.अनु गा इव तस्थिमेन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nānādhiyovasūyavo.anu ghā iva tasthimendrāyendo pari srava ||
Translation: Striving for wealth, with varied plans, we follow our desires like kine. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

Sanskit Text: अश्वो वोळ्हा सुखं रथं हसनामुपमन्त्रिणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvo voḷhā sukhaṃ rathaṃ hasanāmupamantriṇaḥ |
Translation: 4 The horse would draw an easy car, gay hosts attract the laugh and jest.

Sanskit Text: शेपो रोमण्वन्तौ भेदौ वारिन मण्डूक इछतीन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śepo romaṇvantau bhedau vārin maṇḍūka ichatīndrāyendo pari srava ||
Translation: The male desires his mate's approach, the frog is eager for the flood, Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

Sanskit Text: शर्यणावति सोममिन्द्रः पिबतु वर्त्रहा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaryaṇāvati somamindraḥ pibatu vṛtrahā |
Translation: 1. LET Vṛtra-slaying Indra drink Soma by Śaryaṇāvān's side,

Sanskit Text: बलं दधान आत्मनि करिष्यन वीर्यं महदिन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: balaṃ dadhāna ātmani kariṣyan vīryaṃ mahadindrāyendo pari srava ||
Translation: Storing up vigour in his heart, prepared to do heroic deeds. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

Sanskit Text: आ पवस्व दिशां पत आर्जीकात सोम मीढ्वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā pavasva diśāṃ pata ārjīkāt soma mīḍhvaḥ |
Translation: 2 Lord of the Quarters, flow thou on, boon Soma, from Arjika land,

Sanskit Text: रतवाकेन सत्येन शरद्धया तपसा सुत इन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtavākena satyena śraddhayā tapasā suta indrāyendo pari srava ||
Translation: Effused with ardour and with faith, and the true hymn of sacrifice. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

Sanskit Text: पर्जन्यव्र्द्धं महिषं तं सूर्यस्य दुहिताभरत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parjanyavṛddhaṃ mahiṣaṃ taṃ sūryasya duhitābharat |
Translation: 3 Hither hath Sūrya's Daughter brought the wild Steer whom Parjanya nursed.

Sanskit Text: तं गन्धर्वाः परत्यग्र्भ्णन तं सोमे रसमादधुरिन्द्रायेन्दोपरि सरव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ ghandharvāḥ pratyaghṛbhṇan taṃ some rasamādadhurindrāyendopari srava ||
Translation: Gandharvas have seized bold of him, and in the Soma laid the juice. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

Sanskit Text: रतं वदन्न्र्तद्युम्न सत्यं वदन सत्यकर्मन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtaṃ vadannṛtadyumna satyaṃ vadan satyakarman |
Translation: 4 Splendid by Law! declaring Law, truthspeaking, truthful in thy works,

Sanskit Text: शरद्धां वदन सोम राजन धात्रा सोम परिष्क्र्त इन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śraddhāṃ vadan soma rājan dhātrā soma pariṣkṛta indrāyendo pari srava ||
Translation: Enouncing faith, King Soma! thou, O Soma, whom thy maker decks. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

Sanskit Text: सत्यमुग्रस्य बर्हतः सं सरवन्ति संस्रवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satyamughrasya bṛhataḥ saṃ sravanti saṃsravāḥ |
Translation: 5 Together flow the meeting streams of him the Great and truly Strong.

Sanskit Text: सं यन्ति रसिनो रसाः पुनानो बरह्मणा हर इन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yanti rasino rasāḥ punāno brahmaṇā hara indrāyendo pari srava ||
Translation: The juices of the juicy meet. Made pure by prayer, O Golden-hued, flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

Sanskit Text: यत्र बरह्मा पवमान छन्दस्यां वाचं वदन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatra brahmā pavamāna chandasyāṃ vācaṃ vadan |
Translation: 6 O Pavamana, where the priest, as he recites the rhythmic prayer,

Sanskit Text: गराव्णा सोमे महीयते सोमेनानन्दं जनयन्निन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghrāvṇā some mahīyate somenānandaṃ janayannindrāyendo pari srava ||
Translation: Lords it o’er Soma with the stone, with Soma bringing forth delight, flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

Sanskit Text: यत्र जयोतिरजस्रं यस्मिन लोके सवर्हितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatra jyotirajasraṃ yasmin loke svarhitam |
Translation: 7 O Pavarnana, place me in that deathless, undecaying world

Sanskit Text: तस्मिन मां धेहि पवमानाम्र्ते लोके अक्षित इन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmin māṃ dhehi pavamānāmṛte loke akṣita indrāyendo pari srava ||
Translation: Wherein the light of heaven is set, and everlasting lustre shines. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

Sanskit Text: यत्र राजा वैवस्वतो यत्रावरोधनं दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatra rājā vaivasvato yatrāvarodhanaṃ divaḥ |
Translation: 8 Make me immortal in that realm where dwells the King, Vivasvān's Son,

Sanskit Text: यत्रामूर्यह्वतीरापस्तत्र मामम्र्तं कर्धीन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatrāmūryahvatīrāpastatra māmamṛtaṃ kṛdhīndrāyendo pari srava ||
Translation: Where is the secret shrine of heaven, where are those waters young and fresh. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

Sanskit Text: यत्रानुकामं चरणं तरिनाके तरिदिवे दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatrānukāmaṃ caraṇaṃ trināke tridive divaḥ |
Translation: 9 Make me immortal in that realm where they move even as they list,

Sanskit Text: लोका यत्र जयोतिष्मन्तस्तत्र मामम्र्तं कर्धीन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: lokā yatra jyotiṣmantastatra māmamṛtaṃ kṛdhīndrāyendo pari srava ||
Translation: In the third sphere of inmost heaven where lucid worlds are full of light. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

Sanskit Text: यत्र कामा निकामाश्च यत्र बरध्नस्य विष्टपम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatra kāmā nikāmāśca yatra bradhnasya viṣṭapam |
Translation: 10 Make me immortal in that realm of eager wish and strong desire,

Sanskit Text: सवधा च यत्र तर्प्तिश्च तत्र मामम्र्तं कर्धीन्द्रायेन्दो परिस्रव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svadhā ca yatra tṛptiśca tatra māmamṛtaṃ kṛdhīndrāyendo parisrava ||
Translation: The region of the radiant Moon, where food and full delight are found. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake:

Sanskit Text: यत्रानन्दाश्च मोदाश्च मुदः परमुद आसते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatrānandāśca modāśca mudaḥ pramuda āsate |
Translation: 11 Make me immortal in that realm where happiness and transports, where

Sanskit Text: कामस्य यत्राप्ताः कामास्तत्र मामम्र्तं कर्धीन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kāmasya yatrāptāḥ kāmāstatra māmamṛtaṃ kṛdhīndrāyendo pari srava ||
Translation: Joys and felicities combine, and longing wishes are fulfilled. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

Sanskit Text: अग्रे बर्हन्नुषसामूर्ध्वो अस्थान निर्जगन्वान तमसोज्योतिषागात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghre bṛhannuṣasāmūrdhvo asthān nirjaghanvān tamasojyotiṣāghāt |
Translation: 1. HIGH hath the Mighty risen before the dawning, and come to us with light from out the darkness.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्भानुना रुशता सवङग आ जातोविश्वा सद्मान्यप्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirbhānunā ruśatā svaṅgha ā jātoviśvā sadmānyaprāḥ ||
Translation: Fair-shapen Agni with white-shining splendour hath filled at birth all human habitations.

Sanskit Text: स जातो गर्भो असि रोदस्योरग्ने चारुर्विभ्र्त ओषधीषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa jāto gharbho asi rodasyoraghne cārurvibhṛta oṣadhīṣu |
Translation: 2 Thou, being born, art Child of Earth and Heaven, parted among the plants in beauty, Agni!

Sanskit Text: चित्रः शिशुः परि तमांस्यक्तून पर मात्र्भ्यो अधिकनिक्रदत गाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: citraḥ śiśuḥ pari tamāṃsyaktūn pra mātṛbhyo adhikanikradat ghāḥ ||
Translation: The glooms of night thou, Brilliant Babe, subduest, and art come forth, loud roaring, from thy Mothers.

Sanskit Text: विष्णुरित्था परममस्य विद्वाञ जातो बर्हन्नभि पातित्र्तीयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viṣṇuritthā paramamasya vidvāñ jāto bṛhannabhi pātitṛtīyam |
Translation: 3 Here, being manifested, lofty Viṣṇu, full wise, protects his own supremest station.

Sanskit Text: आसा यदस्य पयो अक्रत सवं सचेतसो अभ्यर्चन्त्यत्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsā yadasya payo akrata svaṃ sacetaso abhyarcantyatra ||
Translation: When they have offered in his mouth their sweet milk, to him with one accord they sing forth praises.

Sanskit Text: अत उ तवा पितुभ्र्तो जनित्रीरन्नाव्र्धं परति चरन्त्यन्नैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ata u tvā pitubhṛto janitrīrannāvṛdhaṃ prati carantyannaiḥ |
Translation: 4 Thence bearing food the Mothers come to meet thee, with food for thee who givest food its increase.

Sanskit Text: ता ईं परत्येषि पुनरन्यरूपा असि तवं विक्षुमानुषीषु होता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā īṃ pratyeṣi punaranyarūpā asi tvaṃ vikṣumānuṣīṣu hotā ||
Translation: These in their altered form again thou meetest. Thou art Invoking Priest in homes of mortals.

Sanskit Text: होतारं चित्ररथमध्वरस्य यज्ञस्य-यज्ञस्य केतुंरुशन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotāraṃ citrarathamadhvarasya yajñasya-yajñasya ketuṃruśantam |
Translation: 5 Priest of the holy rite, with car that glitters, refulgent Banner of each act of worship,

Sanskit Text: परत्यर्धिं देवस्य-देवस्य मह्ना शरिया तवग्निमतिथिं जनानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratyardhiṃ devasya-devasya mahnā śriyā tvaghnimatithiṃ janānām ||
Translation: Sharinging every God through might and glory, even Agni Guest of men I summon hither.

Sanskit Text: स तु वस्त्राण्यध पेशनानि वसानो अग्निर्नाभाप्र्थिव्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tu vastrāṇyadha peśanāni vasāno aghnirnābhāpṛthivyāḥ |
Translation: 6 So Agni stands on earth's most central station, invested in well-decorated garments.

Sanskit Text: अरुषो जातः पद इळायाः पुरोहितो राजन्यक्षीह देवान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aruṣo jātaḥ pada iḷāyāḥ purohito rājanyakṣīha devān ||
Translation: Born, red of hue, where men pour out libations, O King, as great High Priest bring the Gods hither.

Sanskit Text: आ हि दयावाप्र्थिवी अग्न उभे सदा पुत्रो न मातराततन्थ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā hi dyāvāpṛthivī aghna ubhe sadā putro na mātarātatantha |
Translation: 7 Over the earth and over heaven, O Agni, thou, Son, hast ever spread above thy Parents.

Sanskit Text: पर याह्यछोशतो यविष्ठाथा वह सहस्येहदेवान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yāhyachośato yaviṣṭhāthā vaha sahasyehadevān ||
Translation: Come, Youthfullest! to those who long to meet thee, and hither bring the Gods, O Mighty Victor.

Sanskit Text: पिप्रीहि देवानुशतो यविष्ठ विद्वान रतून्रतुपतेयजेह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: piprīhi devānuśato yaviṣṭha vidvān ṛtūnrtupateyajeha |
Translation: 1. GLADDEN the yearning Gods, O thou Most Youthful: bring them, O Lord of Seasons, knowing seasons,

Sanskit Text: ये दैव्या रत्विजस्तेभिरग्ने तवं होतॄणामस्यायजिष्ठः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye daivyā ṛtvijastebhiraghne tvaṃ hotṝṇāmasyāyajiṣṭhaḥ ||
Translation: With all the Priests Celestial, O Agni. Best worshipper art thou of all Invokers.

Sanskit Text: वेषि होत्रमुत पोत्रं जनानां मन्धातासि दरविणोदार्तावा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: veṣi hotramuta potraṃ janānāṃ mandhātāsi draviṇodāṛtāvā |
Translation: 2 Thine is the Herald's, thine the Cleanser's office, thinker art thou, wealth-giver, true to Order.

Sanskit Text: सवाहा वयं कर्णवामा हवींषि देवो देवान्यजत्वग्निरर्हन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāhā vayaṃ kṛṇavāmā havīṃṣi devo devānyajatvaghnirarhan ||
Translation: Let us with Svāhā offer up oblations, and Agni, worthy God, pay the Gods worship.

Sanskit Text: आ देवानामपि पन्थामगन्म यच्छक्नवाम तदनुप्रवोळुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā devānāmapi panthāmaghanma yacchaknavāma tadanupravoḷum |
Translation: 3 To the Gods’ pathway have we travelled, ready to execute what work we may accomplish.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्विद्वान स यजात सेदु होता सो अध्वरांस रतून कल्पयाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirvidvān sa yajāt sedu hotā so adhvarāṃsa ṛtūn kalpayāti ||
Translation: Let Agni, for he knows, complete the worship. He is the Priest: let him fix rites and seasons.

Sanskit Text: यद वो वयं परमिनाम वरतानि विदुषं देवाविदुष्टरासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vo vayaṃ pramināma vratāni viduṣaṃ devāaviduṣṭarāsaḥ |
Translation: 4 When we most ignorant neglect the statutes of you, O Deities with whom is knowledge,

Sanskit Text: अग्निष टद विश्वमा पर्णाति विद्वान्येभिर्देवान रतुभिः कल्पयाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṣ ṭad viśvamā pṛṇāti vidvānyebhirdevān ṛtubhiḥ kalpayāti ||
Translation: Wise Agni shall correct our faults and failings, skilled to assign each God his fitting season.

Sanskit Text: यत पाकत्रा मनसा दीनदक्षा न यज्ञस्य मन्वतेमर्त्यासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat pākatrā manasā dīnadakṣā na yajñasya manvatemartyāsaḥ |
Translation: 5 When, weak in mind, of feeble understanding, mortals bethink them not of sacrificing,

Sanskit Text: अग्निष टद धोता करतुविद विजानन्यजिष्ठो देवान रतुशो यजाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṣ ṭad dhotā kratuvid vijānanyajiṣṭho devān ṛtuśo yajāti ||
Translation: Then shall the prudent and discerning Agni worship the Gods, best worshipper, in season.

Sanskit Text: विश्वेषां हयध्वराणामनीकं चित्रं केतुं जनितात्वा जजान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśveṣāṃ hyadhvarāṇāmanīkaṃ citraṃ ketuṃ janitātvā jajāna |
Translation: 6 Because the Father hath produced thee, Leader of all our solemn rites, their brilliant Banner:

Sanskit Text: स आ यजस्व नर्वतीरनु कषा सपार्हािषः कषुमतीर्विश्वजन्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ā yajasva nṛvatīranu kṣā spārhāiṣaḥ kṣumatīrviśvajanyāḥ ||
Translation: So win by worship pleasant homes abounding in heroes, and rich food to nourish all men.

Sanskit Text: यं तवा दयावाप्र्थिवी यं तवापस्त्वष्टा यं तवासुजनिमा जजान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ tvā dyāvāpṛthivī yaṃ tvāpastvaṣṭā yaṃ tvāsujanimā jajāna |
Translation: 7 Thou whom the Heaven and Earth, thou whom the Waters, and Tvaṣṭar, maker of fair things, created,

Sanskit Text: पन्थामनु परविद्वान्पित्र्याणं दयुमदग्ने समिधानो वि भाहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: panthāmanu pravidvānpitṛyāṇaṃ dyumadaghne samidhāno vi bhāhi ||
Translation: Well knowing, all along the Fathers' pathway, shine with resplendent light, enkindled, Agni.

Sanskit Text: इनो राजन्नरतिः समिद्धो रौद्रो दक्षाय सुषुमानदर्शि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ino rājannaratiḥ samiddho raudro dakṣāya suṣumānadarśi |
Translation: 1. O KING, the potent and terrific envoy, kindled for strength, is manifest in beauty.

Sanskit Text: चिकिद वि भाति भासा बर्हतासिक्नीमेति रुशतीमपाजन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cikid vi bhāti bhāsā bṛhatāsiknīmeti ruśatīmapājan ||
Translation: He shines, all-knowing, with his lotty splendour: chasing black Night he comes with white-rayed Morning.

Sanskit Text: कर्ष्णां यदेनीमभि वर्पसा भूज्जनयन योषाम्ब्र्हतः पितुर्जाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṣṇāṃ yadenīmabhi varpasā bhūjjanayan yoṣāmbṛhataḥ piturjām |
Translation: 2 Having o’ercome the glimmering Black with beauty, and bringing forth the dame the Great Sire's Daughter,

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वं भानुं सूर्यस्य सतभायन्दिवो वसुभिररतिर्वि भाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvaṃ bhānuṃ sūryasya stabhāyandivo vasubhiraratirvi bhāti ||
Translation: Holding aloft the radiant light of Sūrya, as messenger of heaven he shines with treasures.

Sanskit Text: भद्रो भद्रया सचमान आगात सवसारं जारो अभ्येतिपश्चात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadro bhadrayā sacamāna āghāt svasāraṃ jāro abhyetipaścāt |
Translation: 3 Attendant on the Blessed Dame the Blessed hath come: the Lover followeth his Sister.

Sanskit Text: सुप्रकेतैर्द्युभिरग्निर्वितिष्ठन रुशद्भिर्वर्णैरभि राममस्थात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: supraketairdyubhiraghnirvitiṣṭhan ruśadbhirvarṇairabhi rāmamasthāt ||
Translation: Agni, far-spreading with conspicuous lustre, hath compassed Night with whitelyshining garments.

Sanskit Text: अस्य यामासो बर्हतो न वग्नूनिन्धाना अग्नेः सख्युःशिवस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya yāmāso bṛhato na vaghnūnindhānā aghneḥ sakhyuḥśivasya |
Translation: 4 His goings-forth kindle as ’twere high voices the goings of the auspicious Friend of Agni.

Sanskit Text: इड्यस्य वर्ष्णो बर्हतः सवासो भामासो यामन्नक्तवश्चिकित्रे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iḍyasya vṛṣṇo bṛhataḥ svāso bhāmāso yāmannaktavaścikitre ||
Translation: The rays, the bright beams of the strong-jawed, mighty, adorable Steer are visible as he cometh.

Sanskit Text: सवना न यस्य भामासः पवन्ते रोचमानस्य बर्हतःसुदिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svanā na yasya bhāmāsaḥ pavante rocamānasya bṛhataḥsudivaḥ |
Translation: 5 Whose radiant splendours flow, like sounds, about us, his who is lofty, brilliant, and effulgent,

Sanskit Text: जयेष्ठेभिर्यस्तेजिष्ठैः करीळुमद्भिर्वर्षिष्ठेभिर्भानुभिर्नक्षति दयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyeṣṭhebhiryastejiṣṭhaiḥ krīḷumadbhirvarṣiṣṭhebhirbhānubhirnakṣati dyām ||
Translation: Who reaches heaven with best and brightest lustres, sportive and piercing even to the summit.

Sanskit Text: अस्य शुष्मासो दद्र्शानपवेर्जेहमानस्य सवनयन नियुद्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya śuṣmāso dadṛśānapaverjehamānasya svanayan niyudbhiḥ |
Translation: 6 His powers, whose chariot fellies gleam and glitter have loudly roared while, as with teams, he hasted.

Sanskit Text: परत्नेभिर्यो रुशद्भिर्देवतमो वि रेभद्भिररतिर्भाति विभ्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratnebhiryo ruśadbhirdevatamo vi rebhadbhiraratirbhāti vibhvā ||
Translation: He, the most Godlike, far-extending envoy, shines with flames ancient, resonant, whitely-shining.

Sanskit Text: स आ वक्षि महि न आ च सत्सि दिवस्प्र्थिव्योररतिर्युवत्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa ā vakṣi mahi na ā ca satsi divaspṛthivyoraratiryuvatyoḥ |
Translation: 7 So bring us ample wealth: seat thee as envoy of the two youthful Matrons, Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: अग्निः सुतुकः सुतुकेभिरश्वै रभस्वद्भीरभस्वानेह गम्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniḥ sutukaḥ sutukebhiraśvai rabhasvadbhīrabhasvāneha ghamyāḥ ||
Translation: Let Agni rapid with his rapid, horses, impetuous with impetuous Steeds, come hither.

Sanskit Text: पर ते यक्षि पर त इयर्मि मन्म भुवो यथा वन्द्यो नोहवेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te yakṣi pra ta iyarmi manma bhuvo yathā vandyo nohaveṣu |
Translation: 1. To thee will send praise and bring oblation, as thou hast merited lauds when we invoked thee.

Sanskit Text: धन्वन्निव परपा असि तवमग्न इयक्षवे पूरवेप्रत्न राजन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhanvanniva prapā asi tvamaghna iyakṣave pūravepratna rājan ||
Translation: A fountain in the desert art thou, Agni, O Ancient King, to man who fain would worship,

Sanskit Text: यं तवा जनासो अभि संचरन्ति गाव उष्णमिव वरजंयविष्ठ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ tvā janāso abhi saṃcaranti ghāva uṣṇamiva vrajaṃyaviṣṭha |
Translation: 2 Thou unto whom resort the gathered people, as the kine seek the warm stall, O Most Youthful.

Sanskit Text: दूतो देवानामसि मर्त्यानामन्तर्महांश्चरसि रोचनेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūto devānāmasi martyānāmantarmahāṃścarasi rocanena ||
Translation: Thou art the messenger of Gods and mortals, and goest glorious with thy light between them.

Sanskit Text: शिशुं न तवा जेन्यं वर्धयन्ती माता बिभर्तिसचनस्यमाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śiśuṃ na tvā jenyaṃ vardhayantī mātā bibhartisacanasyamānā |
Translation: 3 Making thee grow as ’twere some noble infant, thy Mother nurtures thee with sweet affection.

Sanskit Text: धनोरधि परवता यासि हर्यञ जिगीषसेपशुरिवावस्र्ष्टः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhanoradhi pravatā yāsi haryañ jighīṣasepaśurivāvasṛṣṭaḥ ||
Translation: Over the desert slopes thou passest longing, and seekest, like some beast set free, thy fodder.

Sanskit Text: मूरा अमूर न वयं चिकित्वो महित्वमग्ने तवमङग वित्से |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mūrā amūra na vayaṃ cikitvo mahitvamaghne tvamaṅgha vitse |
Translation: 4 Foolish are we, O Wise and free from error: verily, Agni, thou dost know thy grandeur.

Sanskit Text: शये वव्रिश्चरति जिह्वयादन रेरिह्यते युवतिंविश्पतिः सन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaye vavriścarati jihvayādan rerihyate yuvatiṃviśpatiḥ san ||
Translation: There lies the form: he moves and licks, and swallows, and, as House-Lord, kisses the Youthful Maiden.

Sanskit Text: कूचिज्जायते सनयासु नव्यो वने तस्थौ पलितो धूमकेतुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kūcijjāyate sanayāsu navyo vane tasthau palito dhūmaketuḥ |
Translation: 5 He rises ever fresh in ancient fuel: smoke-bannered, gray, he makes the wood his dwelling.

Sanskit Text: अस्नातापो वर्षभो न पर वेति सचेतसो यं पर्णयन्तमर्ताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asnātāpo vṛṣabho na pra veti sacetaso yaṃ parṇayantamartāḥ ||
Translation: No swimmer, Steer, he presses through the waters, and to his place accordant mortals bear him.

Sanskit Text: तनूत्यजेव तस्करा वनर्गु रशनाभिर्दशभिरभ्यधीताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tanūtyajeva taskarā vanarghu raśanābhirdaśabhirabhyadhītām |
Translation: 6 Like thieves who risk their lives and haunt the forest, the twain with their ten girdles have secured him.

Sanskit Text: इयं ते अग्ने नव्यसी मनीषा युक्ष्वा रथंन शुचयद्भिरङगैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyaṃ te aghne navyasī manīṣā yukṣvā rathaṃna śucayadbhiraṅghaiḥ ||
Translation: This is a new hymn meant for thee, O Agni: yoke as it were thy car with parts that glitter.

Sanskit Text: बरह्म च ते जातवेदो नमश्चेयं च गीः सदमिद्वर्धनी भूत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahma ca te jātavedo namaśceyaṃ ca ghīḥ sadamidvardhanī bhūt |
Translation: 7 Homage and prayer are thine, O Jātavedas, and this my song shall evermore exalt thee.

Sanskit Text: रक्षा णो अग्ने तनयानि तोका रक्षोत नस्तन्वो अप्रयुछन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rakṣā ṇo aghne tanayāni tokā rakṣota nastanvo aprayuchan ||
Translation: Agni, protect our children and descendants, and guard with ever-watcliful care our bodies.

Sanskit Text: एकः समुद्रो धरुणो रयीणामस्मद धर्दो भूरिजन्मा विचष्टे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ekaḥ samudro dharuṇo rayīṇāmasmad dhṛdo bhūrijanmā vicaṣṭe |
Translation: 1. HE only is the Sea, holder of treasures: born many a time he views the hearts within us.

Sanskit Text: सिषक्त्यूधर्निण्योरुपस्थ उत्सस्य मध्येनिहितं पदं वेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: siṣaktyūdharniṇyorupastha utsasya madhyenihitaṃ padaṃ veḥ ||
Translation: He hides him in the secret couple's bosom. The Bird dwells in the middle of the fountain.

Sanskit Text: समानं नीळं वर्षणो वसानाः सं जग्मिरे महिषार्वतीभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samānaṃ nīḷaṃ vṛṣaṇo vasānāḥ saṃ jaghmire mahiṣāarvatībhiḥ |
Translation: 2 Inhabiting one dwelling-place in common, strong Stallions and the Mares have come together.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य पदं कवयो नि पान्ति गुहा नामानिदधिरे पराणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya padaṃ kavayo ni pānti ghuhā nāmānidadhire parāṇi ||
Translation: The sages guard the seat of Holy Order, and keep the highest names concealed within them.

Sanskit Text: रतायिनी मायिनी सं दधाते मित्वा शिशुं जज्ञतुर्वर्धयन्ती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtāyinī māyinī saṃ dadhāte mitvā śiśuṃ jajñaturvardhayantī |
Translation: 3 The Holy Pair, of wondrous power, have coupled: they formed the Infant, they who bred produced him.

Sanskit Text: विश्वस्य नाभिं चरतो धरुवस्य कवेश्चित्तन्तुं मनसा वियन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvasya nābhiṃ carato dhruvasya kaveścittantuṃ manasā viyantaḥ ||
Translation: The central point of all that moves and moves not, the while they wove the Sage's thread with insight

Sanskit Text: रतस्य हि वर्तनयः सुजातमिषो वाजाय परदिवःसचन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya hi vartanayaḥ sujātamiṣo vājāya pradivaḥsacante |
Translation: 4 For tracks of Order and refreshing viands attend from ancient times the goodly Infant.

Sanskit Text: अधीवासं रोदसी वावसाने घर्तैरन्नैर्वाव्र्धाते मधूनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhīvāsaṃ rodasī vāvasāne ghṛtairannairvāvṛdhāte madhūnām ||
Translation: Wearing him as a mantle, Earth and Heaven grow strong by food of pleasant drink and fatness.

Sanskit Text: सप्त सवसॄररुषीर्वावशानो विद्वान मध्व उज्जभाराद्र्शे कम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sapta svasṝraruṣīrvāvaśāno vidvān madhva ujjabhārādṛśe kam |
Translation: 5 He, calling loudly to the Seven red Sisters, hath, skilled in sweet drink, brought them to be looked on.

Sanskit Text: अन्तर्येमे अन्तरिक्षे पुराजा इछन वव्रिमविदत्पूषणस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: antaryeme antarikṣe purājā ichan vavrimavidatpūṣaṇasya ||
Translation: He, born of old, in middle air hath halted, and sought and found the covering robe of Pūṣan.

Sanskit Text: सप्त मर्यादाः कवयस्ततक्षुस्तासामेकामिदभ्यंहुरो गात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sapta maryādāḥ kavayastatakṣustāsāmekāmidabhyaṃhuro ghāt |
Translation: 6 Seven are the pathways which the wise have fashioned; to one of these may come the troubled mortal.

Sanskit Text: आयोर्ह सकम्भ उपमस्य नीळे पथांविसर्गे धरुणेषु तस्थौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āyorha skambha upamasya nīḷe pathāṃvisarghe dharuṇeṣu tasthau ||
Translation: He standeth in the dwelling of the Highest, a Pillar, on sure ground where paths are parted.

Sanskit Text: असच्च सच्च परमे वयोमन दक्षस्य जन्मन्नदितेरुपस्थे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asacca sacca parame vyoman dakṣasya janmannaditerupasthe |
Translation: 7 Not Being, Being in the highest heaven, in Aditi's bosom and in Dakṣa's birthplace,

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्ह नः पर थमजा रतस्य पूर्व आयुनि वर्षभश्चधेनुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirha naḥ pra thamajā ṛtasya pūrva āyuni vṛṣabhaścadhenuḥ ||
Translation: Is Agni, our first-born of Holy Order, the Milch-cow and the Bull in life's beginning.

Sanskit Text: अयं स यस्य शर्मन्नवोभिरग्नेरेधते जरिताभिष्टौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ sa yasya śarmannavobhiraghneredhate jaritābhiṣṭau |
Translation: 1. THIS is that Agni, he by whose protection, favour, and help. the singer is successful;

Sanskit Text: जयेष्ठेभिर्यो भानुभिरषूणां पर्येति परिवीतोविभावा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyeṣṭhebhiryo bhānubhirṣūṇāṃ paryeti parivītovibhāvā ||
Translation: Who with the noblest flames of glowing fuel comes forth encompassed with far-spreading lustre.

Sanskit Text: यो भनुभिर्विभावा विभात्यग्निर्देवेभिरतावाजस्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo bhanubhirvibhāvā vibhātyaghnirdevebhirtāvājasraḥ |
Translation: 2 Agni, the Holy One, the everlasting, who shines far beaming with celestial splendours;

Sanskit Text: आ यो विवाय सख्या सखिभ्यो.अपरिह्व्र्तो अत्यो न सप्तिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yo vivāya sakhyā sakhibhyo.aparihvṛto atyo na saptiḥ ||
Translation: He who hath come unto his friends with friendship, like a fleet steed who never trips or stumbles.

Sanskit Text: ईशे यो विश्वस्या देववीतेरीशे विश्वायुरुषसोव्युष्टौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īśe yo viśvasyā devavīterīśe viśvāyuruṣasovyuṣṭau |
Translation: 3 He who is Lord of all divine oblation, shared by all living men at break of morning,

Sanskit Text: आ यस्मिन मना हवींष्यग्नावरिष्टरथस्कभ्नाति शूषैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yasmin manā havīṃṣyaghnāvariṣṭarathaskabhnāti śūṣaiḥ ||
Translation: Agni to whom our offerings are devoted, in whom rests he whose car, through might, is scatheless.

Sanskit Text: शूषेभिर्व्र्धो जुषाणो अर्कैर्देवानछा रघुपत्वाजिगाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śūṣebhirvṛdho juṣāṇo arkairdevānachā raghupatvājighāti |
Translation: 4 Increasing by his strength. while lauds content him, with easy flight unto the Gods he travels.

Sanskit Text: मन्द्रो होता स जुह्वा यजिष्ठः सम्मिश्लो अग्निरा जिघर्ति देवान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mandro hotā sa juhvā yajiṣṭhaḥ sammiślo aghnirā jigharti devān ||
Translation: Agni the cheerful Priest, best Sacrificer, balms with his tongue the Gods with whom he mingles.

Sanskit Text: तमुस्रामिन्द्रं न रेजमानमग्निं गीर्भिर्नमोभिराक्र्णुध्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamusrāmindraṃ na rejamānamaghniṃ ghīrbhirnamobhirākṛṇudhvam |
Translation: 5 With songs and adorations bring ye hither Agni who stirs himself at dawn like Indra,

Sanskit Text: आ यं विप्रासो मतिभिर्ग्र्णन्ति जातवेदसंजुह्वं सहानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yaṃ viprāso matibhirghṛṇanti jātavedasaṃjuhvaṃ sahānām ||
Translation: Whom sages laud with hymns as Jātavedas of those who wield the sacrificial ladle.

Sanskit Text: सं यस्मिन विश्वा वसूनि जग्मुर्वाजे नाश्वाःसप्तीवन्त एवैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yasmin viśvā vasūni jaghmurvāje nāśvāḥsaptīvanta evaiḥ |
Translation: 6 In whom all goodly treasures meet together, even as steeds and riders for the booty.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे ऊतीरिन्द्रवाततमा अर्वाचीनाग्न आ कर्णुष्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme ūtīrindravātatamā arvācīnāaghna ā kṛṇuṣva ||
Translation: Inclining hither bring us help, O Agni, even assistance most desired by Indra.

Sanskit Text: अधा हयग्ने मह्ना निषद्या सद्यो जज्ञानो हव्यो बभूथ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā hyaghne mahnā niṣadyā sadyo jajñāno havyo babhūtha |
Translation: 7 Yea, at thy birth, when thou hadst sat in glory, thou, Agni, wast the aim of invocations.

Sanskit Text: तं ते देवासो अनु केतमायन्नधावर्धन्त परथमासूमाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ te devāso anu ketamāyannadhāvardhanta prathamāsaūmāḥ ||
Translation: The Gods came near, obedient to thy sunimons, and thus attained their rank as chief Protectors.

Sanskit Text: सवस्ति नो दिवो अग्ने पर्थिव्या विश्वायुर्धेहि यजथाय देव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svasti no divo aghne pṛthivyā viśvāyurdhehi yajathāya deva |
Translation: 1. O AGNI, shared by all men living bring us good luck for sacrifice from earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: सचेमहि तव दस्म परकेतैरुरुष्या ण उरुभिर्देवशंसैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sacemahi tava dasma praketairuruṣyā ṇa urubhirdevaśaṃsaiḥ ||
Translation: With us be thine intelligence, WonderWorker! Protect us, God, with thy far-reaching blessings.

Sanskit Text: इमा अग्ने मतयस्तुभ्यं जाता गोभिरश्वैरभि गर्णन्तिरधः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā aghne matayastubhyaṃ jātā ghobhiraśvairabhi ghṛṇantiradhaḥ |
Translation: 2 These hymns brought forth for thee, O Agni, laud thee for bounteous gifts, with cattle and with horses.

Sanskit Text: यदा ते मर्तो अनु भोगमानड वसो दधानोमतिभिः सुजात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā te marto anu bhoghamānaḍ vaso dadhānomatibhiḥ sujāta ||
Translation: Good Lord, when man from thee hath gained enjoyment, by hymns, O noblyborn, hath he obtained it.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं मन्ये पितरमग्निमापिमग्निं भरातरं सदमित्सखायम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ manye pitaramaghnimāpimaghniṃ bhrātaraṃ sadamitsakhāyam |
Translation: 3 Agni I deem my Kinsman and my Father, count him my Brother and my Friend for ever.

Sanskit Text: अग्नेरनीकं बर्हतः सपर्यं दिवि शुक्रंयजतं सूर्यस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghneranīkaṃ bṛhataḥ saparyaṃ divi śukraṃyajataṃ sūryasya ||
Translation: I honour as the face of lofty Agni in heaven the bright and holy light of Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: सिध्रा अग्ने धियो अस्मे सनुत्रीर्यं तरायसे दम आनित्यहोता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sidhrā aghne dhiyo asme sanutrīryaṃ trāyase dama ānityahotā |
Translation: 4 Effectual, Agni, are our prayers for profit. He whom, at home thou, Priest for ever, guardest

Sanskit Text: रतवा स रोहिदश्वः पुरुक्षुर्द्युभिरस्माहभिर्वाममस्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtavā sa rohidaśvaḥ purukṣurdyubhirasmāahabhirvāmamastu ||
Translation: Is rich in food, drawn by red steeds, and holy: by day and night to him shall all be pleasant.

Sanskit Text: दयुभिर्हितं मित्रमिव परयोगं परत्नं रत्विजमध्वरस्यजारम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyubhirhitaṃ mitramiva prayoghaṃ pratnaṃ ṛtvijamadhvarasyajāram |
Translation: 5 Men with their arms have generated Agni, helpful as some kind friend, adorned with splendours,

Sanskit Text: बाहुभ्यामग्निमायवो.अजनन्त विक्षु होतारं नयसादयन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bāhubhyāmaghnimāyavo.ajananta vikṣu hotāraṃ nyasādayanta ||
Translation: And stablished as Invoker mid the people the ancient Priest the sacrifice's lover.

Sanskit Text: सवयं यजस्व दिवि देव देवान किं ते पाकः कर्णवदप्रचेताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svayaṃ yajasva divi deva devān kiṃ te pākaḥ kṛṇavadapracetāḥ |
Translation: 6 Worship, thyself, O God, the Gods in heaven: what, void of knowledge, shall the fool avail thee?

Sanskit Text: यथायज रतुभिर्देव देवानेवा यजस्वतन्वं सुजात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathāyaja ṛtubhirdeva devānevā yajasvatanvaṃ sujāta ||
Translation: As thou, O God, hast worshipped Gods by seasons, so, nobly-born! to thine own self pay worship.

Sanskit Text: भवा नो अग्ने.अवितोत गोपा भवा वयस्क्र्दुत नोवयोधाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhavā no aghne.avitota ghopā bhavā vayaskṛduta novayodhāḥ |
Translation: 7 Agni, be thou our Guardian and Protector bestow upon us life and vital vigour.

Sanskit Text: रास्वा च नः सुमहो हव्यदातिं तरास्वोत नस्तन्वो अप्रयुछन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāsvā ca naḥ sumaho havyadātiṃ trāsvota nastanvo aprayuchan ||
Translation: Accept, O Mighty One, the gifts we offer, and with unceasing care protect our bodies.

Sanskit Text: पर केतुना बर्हता यात्यग्निरा रोदसी वर्षभो रोरवीति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ketunā bṛhatā yātyaghnirā rodasī vṛṣabho roravīti |
Translation: 1. AGNI advances with his lofty banner: the Bull is bellowing to the earth and heavens.

Sanskit Text: दिवश्चिदन्तानुपमानुदानळ अपामुपस्थे महिषोववर्ध ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divaścidantānupamānudānaḷ apāmupasthe mahiṣovavardha ||
Translation: He hath attained the sky's supremest limits. the Steer hath waxen in the lap of waters.

Sanskit Text: मुमोद गर्भो वर्षभः ककुद्मानस्रेमा वत्सः शिमीवानरावीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mumoda gharbho vṛṣabhaḥ kakudmānasremā vatsaḥ śimīvānarāvīt |
Translation: 2 The Bull, the youngling with the hump, hath frolicked, the strong and never-ceasing Calf hath bellowed.

Sanskit Text: स देवतात्युद्यतानि कर्ण्वन सवेषु कषयेषुप्रथमो जिगाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa devatātyudyatāni kṛṇvan sveṣu kṣayeṣuprathamo jighāti ||
Translation: Bringing our offerings to the God's assembly, he moves as Chief in his own dwelling-places.

Sanskit Text: आ यो मूर्धानं पित्रोररब्ध नयध्वरे दधिरे सूरोर्णः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yo mūrdhānaṃ pitrorarabdha nyadhvare dadhire sūroarṇaḥ |
Translation: 3 Him who hath grasped his Parents' head, they stablished at sacrifice a wave of heavenly lustre.

Sanskit Text: अस्य पत्मन्नरुषीरश्वभुध्ना रतस्य योनौतन्वो जुषन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya patmannaruṣīraśvabhudhnā ṛtasya yonautanvo juṣanta ||
Translation: In his swift flight the red Dawns borne by horses refresh their bodies in the home of Order.

Sanskit Text: उष-उषो हि वसो अग्रमेषि तवं यमयोरभवो विभावा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣa-uṣo hi vaso aghrameṣi tvaṃ yamayorabhavo vibhāvā |
Translation: 4 For, Vasu thou precedest every Morning, and still hast been the Twins' illuminator.

Sanskit Text: रताय सप्त दधिषे पदानि जनयन मित्रं तन्वे सवायै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtāya sapta dadhiṣe padāni janayan mitraṃ tanve svāyai ||
Translation: For sacrifice, seven places thou retainest while for thine own self thou engenderest Mitra.

Sanskit Text: भुवश्चक्षुर्मह रतस्य गोपा भुवो वरुणो यद रतायवेषि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhuvaścakṣurmaha ṛtasya ghopā bhuvo varuṇo yad ṛtāyaveṣi |
Translation: 5 Thou art the Eye and Guard of mighty Order, and Varuṇa when to sacrifice thou comest.

Sanskit Text: भुवो अपां नपाज्जातवेदो भुवो दूतो यस्यहव्यं जुजोषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhuvo apāṃ napājjātavedo bhuvo dūto yasyahavyaṃ jujoṣaḥ ||
Translation: Thou art the Waters’ Child O Jātavedas, envoy of him whose offering thou acceptest.

Sanskit Text: भुवो यज्ञस्य रजसश्च नेता यत्रा नियुद्भिः सचसेशिवाभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhuvo yajñasya rajasaśca netā yatrā niyudbhiḥ sacaseśivābhiḥ |
Translation: 6 Thou art the Leader of the rite and region, to which with thine auspicious teams thou teadest,

Sanskit Text: दिवि मूर्धानं दधिषे सवर्षां जिह्वामग्नेचक्र्षे हव्यवाहम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divi mūrdhānaṃ dadhiṣe svarṣāṃ jihvāmaghnecakṛṣe havyavāham ||
Translation: Thy light-bestowing head to heaven thou liftest, making thy tongue the oblationbearer, Agni.

Sanskit Text: अस्य तरितः करतुना वव्रे अन्तरिछन धीतिं पितुरेवैःपरस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya tritaḥ kratunā vavre antarichan dhītiṃ piturevaiḥparasya |
Translation: 7 Through his wise insight Trita in the cavern, seeking as ever the Chief Sire's intention,

Sanskit Text: सचस्यमानः पित्रोरुपस्थे जामि बरुवाणायुधानि वेति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sacasyamānaḥ pitrorupasthe jāmi bruvāṇaāyudhāni veti ||
Translation: Carefully tended in his Parents' bosom, calling the weapons kin, goes forth to combat.

Sanskit Text: स पित्र्याण्यायुधनि विद्वनिन्द्रेषित आप्त्यो अभ्ययुध्यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pitryāṇyāyudhani vidvanindreṣita āptyo abhyayudhyat |
Translation: 8 Well-skilled to use the weapons of his Father, Āptya, urged on by Indra, fought the battle.

Sanskit Text: तरिशीर्षाणं सप्तरश्मिं जघन्वान तवाष्ट्रस्य चिन्निः सस्र्जे तरितो गाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: triśīrṣāṇaṃ saptaraśmiṃ jaghanvān tvāṣṭrasya cinniḥ sasṛje trito ghāḥ ||
Translation: Then Trita slew the foe seven-rayed, three-headed, and freed the cattle of the Son of Tvaṣṭar.

Sanskit Text: भूरीदिन्द्र उदिनक्षन्तमोजो.अवाभिनत सत्पतिर्मन्यमानम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūrīdindra udinakṣantamojo.avābhinat satpatirmanyamānam |
Translation: 9 Lord of the brave, Indra cleft him in pieces who sought to gain much strength and deemed him mighty.

Sanskit Text: तवाष्ट्रस्य चिद विश्वरूपस्य गोनामाचक्रणस्त्रीणि शीर्षा परा वर्क ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṣṭrasya cid viśvarūpasya ghonāmācakraṇastrīṇi śīrṣā parā vark ||
Translation: He smote his three heads from his body, seizing the cattle of the oniniform Son of Tvaṣṭar.

Sanskit Text: आपो हि षठा मयोभुवस्ता न ऊर्जे दधातन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpo hi ṣṭhā mayobhuvastā na ūrje dadhātana |
Translation: 1. YE, Waters, are beneficent: so help ye us to energy

Sanskit Text: महेरणाय चक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maheraṇāya cakṣase ||
Translation: That we may look on great delight.

Sanskit Text: यो वः शिवतमो रसस्तस्य भजयतेह नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vaḥ śivatamo rasastasya bhajayateha naḥ |
Translation: 2 Give us a portion of the sap, the most auspicious that ye have,

Sanskit Text: उशतीरिवमातरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uśatīrivamātaraḥ ||
Translation: Like mothers in their longing love.

Sanskit Text: तस्मा अरं गमाम वो यस्य कषयाय जिन्वथ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmā araṃ ghamāma vo yasya kṣayāya jinvatha |
Translation: 3 To you we gladly come for him to whose abode ye send us on;

Sanskit Text: आपोजनयथा च नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpojanayathā ca naḥ ||
Translation: And, Waters, give us procreant strength.

Sanskit Text: शं नो देवीरभिष्टय आपो भवन्तु पीतये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no devīrabhiṣṭaya āpo bhavantu pītaye |
Translation: 4 The Waters. be to us for drink, Goddesses for our aid and bliss:

Sanskit Text: शं योरभि सरवन्तु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ yorabhi sravantu naḥ ||
Translation: Let them stream to us health and strength.

Sanskit Text: ईशाना वार्याणां कषयन्तीश्चर्षणीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īśānā vāryāṇāṃ kṣayantīścarṣaṇīnām |
Translation: 5 1 beg the Floods to give us balm, these Queens who rule o’er precious things,

Sanskit Text: अपोयाचामि भेषजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apoyācāmi bheṣajam ||
Translation: And have supreme control of men.

Sanskit Text: अप्सु मे सोमो अब्रवीदन्तर्विश्वानि भेषजा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apsu me somo abravīdantarviśvāni bheṣajā |
Translation: 6 Within the Waters-Soma thus hath told me-dwell all balms that heal,

Sanskit Text: अग्निं चविश्वशम्भुवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ caviśvaśambhuvam ||
Translation: And Agni, he who blesseth all.

Sanskit Text: आपः पर्णीत भेषजां वरूथं तन्वे मम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpaḥ pṛṇīta bheṣajāṃ varūthaṃ tanve mama |
Translation: 7 O Waters, teem with medicine to keep my body safe from harm,

Sanskit Text: जयोक चसूर्यं दर्शे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyok casūryaṃ dṛśe ||
Translation: So that I long may see the Sun.

Sanskit Text: इदमापः पर वहत यत किं च दुरितं मयि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idamāpaḥ pra vahata yat kiṃ ca duritaṃ mayi |
Translation: 8 Whatever sin is found in me, whatever evil I have wrought,

Sanskit Text: यद वाहमभिदुद्रोह यद व शेप उतान्र्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vāhamabhidudroha yad va śepa utānṛtam ||
Translation: If I have lied or falsely sworn, Waters, remove it far from me.

Sanskit Text: आपो अद्यान्वचारिषं रसेन समगस्महि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpo adyānvacāriṣaṃ rasena samaghasmahi |
Translation: 9 The Waters I this day have sought, and to their moisture have we come:

Sanskit Text: पयस्वानग्ना गहि तं मा सं सर्ज वर्चसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: payasvānaghnaā ghahi taṃ mā saṃ sṛja varcasā ||
Translation: O Agni, rich in milk, come thou, and with thy splendour cover me.

Sanskit Text: ओ चित सखायं सख्या वव्र्त्यां तिरः पुरू चिदर्णवंजगन्वन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: o cit sakhāyaṃ sakhyā vavṛtyāṃ tiraḥ purū cidarṇavaṃjaghanvan |
Translation: 1. FAIN would I win my friend to kindly friendship. So may the Sage, come through the air's wide ocean,

Sanskit Text: पितुर्नपातमा दधीत वेधा अधि कषमिप्रतरं दिध्यानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: piturnapātamā dadhīta vedhā adhi kṣamiprataraṃ didhyānaḥ ||
Translation: Remembering the earth and days to follow, obtain a son, the issue of his father.

Sanskit Text: न ते सखा सख्यं वष्ट्येतत सलक्ष्मा यद विषुरूपाभवाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na te sakhā sakhyaṃ vaṣṭyetat salakṣmā yad viṣurūpābhavāti |
Translation: 2 Thy friend loves not the friendship which considers her who is near in kindred as stranger.

Sanskit Text: महस पुत्रसो असुरस्य वीरा दिवो धर्तारौर्विया परि खयन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahas putraso asurasya vīrā divo dhartāraurviyā pari khyan ||
Translation: Sons of the mighty Asura, the Heroes, supporters of the heavens, see far around them.

Sanskit Text: उशन्ति घा ते अम्र्तास एतदेकस्य चित तयजसं मर्त्यस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uśanti ghā te amṛtāsa etadekasya cit tyajasaṃ martyasya |
Translation: 3 Yea, this the Immortals seek of thee with longing, progeny of the sole existing mortal.

Sanskit Text: नि ते मनो मनसि धाय्यस्मे जन्युः पतिस्तन्वमाविविश्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni te mano manasi dhāyyasme janyuḥ patistanvamāviviśyāḥ ||
Translation: Then let thy soul and mine be knit together, and as a loving husband take thy consort.

Sanskit Text: न यत पुरा चक्र्मा कद ध नूनं रता वदन्तो अन्र्तंरपेम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yat purā cakṛmā kad dha nūnaṃ ṛtā vadanto anṛtaṃrapema |
Translation: 4 Shall we do now what we ne’er did aforetime? we who spake righteously now talk impurely?

Sanskit Text: गन्धर्वो अप्स्वप्या च योषा सा नो नाभिःपरमं जामि तन नौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghandharvo apsvapyā ca yoṣā sā no nābhiḥparamaṃ jāmi tan nau ||
Translation: Gandharva in the floods, the Dame of Waters-such is our bond, such our most lofty kinship.

Sanskit Text: गर्भे नु नौ जनिता दम्पती कर्देवास्त्वष्टा सविताविश्वरूपः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: gharbhe nu nau janitā dampatī kardevāstvaṣṭā savitāviśvarūpaḥ |
Translation: 5 Even in the womb God Tvaṣṭar, Vivifier, shaping all forms, Creator, made us consorts.

Sanskit Text: नाकिरस्य पर मिनन्ति वरतानि वेद नावस्यप्र्थिवि उत दयौः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nākirasya pra minanti vratāni veda nāvasyapṛthivi uta dyauḥ ||
Translation: None violates his holy ordinances: that we are his the heavens and earth acknowledge.

Sanskit Text: को अस्य वेद परथमस्याह्नः क ईं ददर्श क इह परवोचत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko asya veda prathamasyāhnaḥ ka īṃ dadarśa ka iha pravocat |
Translation: 6 Who knows that earliest day whereof thou speakest? Who hatb beheld it? Who can here declare it?

Sanskit Text: बर्हन मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धाम कदु बरव आहनोवीच्या नॄन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhan mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma kadu brava āhanovīcyā nṝn ||
Translation: Great is the Law of Varuṇa and Mitra. What, wanton! wilt thou say to men to tempt them?

Sanskit Text: यमस्य मा यम्यं काम आगन समाने योनौ सहशेय्याय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamasya mā yamyaṃ kāma āghan samāne yonau sahaśeyyāya |
Translation: 7 I, Yami, am possessed by love of Yama, that I may rest on the same couch beside him.

Sanskit Text: जायेव पत्ये तन्वं रिरिच्यां वि चिद वर्हेव रथ्येव चक्रा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jāyeva patye tanvaṃ riricyāṃ vi cid vṛheva rathyeva cakrā ||
Translation: I as a wife would yield me to my husband. Like car-wheels let us speed to meet each other.

Sanskit Text: न तिष्ठन्ति न नि मिषन्त्येते देवानां सपश इह येचरन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na tiṣṭhanti na ni miṣantyete devānāṃ spaśa iha yecaranti |
Translation: 8 They stand not still, they never close their eyelids, those sentinels of Gods who wander round us.

Sanskit Text: अन्येन मदाहनो याहि तुयं तेन वि वर्ह रथ्येवचक्रा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anyena madāhano yāhi tuyaṃ tena vi vṛha rathyevacakrā ||
Translation: Not me-go quickly, wanton, with another, and hasten like a chariot wheel to meet him.

Sanskit Text: रात्रीभिरस्मा अहभिर्दशस्येत सूर्यस्य चक्षुर्मुहुरुन्मिमीयात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rātrībhirasmā ahabhirdaśasyet sūryasya cakṣurmuhurunmimīyāt |
Translation: 9 May Sūrya's eye with days and nights endow him, and ever may his light spread out before him.

Sanskit Text: दिवा पर्थिव्या मिथुना सबन्धू यमीर्यमस्यबिभ्र्यादजामि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divā pṛthivyā mithunā sabandhū yamīryamasyabibhṛyādajāmi ||
Translation: In heaven and earth the kindred Pair commingle. On Yam! be the unbrotherly act of Yama.

Sanskit Text: आ घा ता गछानुत्तरा युगानि यत्र जामयः कर्णवन्नजामि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ghā tā ghachānuttarā yughāni yatra jāmayaḥ kṛṇavannajāmi |
Translation: 10 Sure there will come succeeding times when brothers and sisters will do acts unmeet for kinsfolk.

Sanskit Text: उप बर्ब्र्हि वर्षभाय बाहुमन्यमिछस्व सुभगेपतिं मत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa barbṛhi vṛṣabhāya bāhumanyamichasva subhaghepatiṃ mat ||
Translation: Not me, O fair one,—seek another husband, and make thine arm a pillow for thy consort.

Sanskit Text: किं भरतासद यदनाथं भवाति किमु सवसा यन निरतिर्निगछत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kiṃ bhratāsad yadanāthaṃ bhavāti kimu svasā yan nirtirnighachat |
Translation: 11 Is he a brother when no lord is left her? Is she a sister when Destruction cometh?

Sanskit Text: काममूता बह्वेतद रपामि तन्वा मे तन्वं सम्पिप्र्ग्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kāmamūtā bahvetad rapāmi tanvā me tanvaṃ sampipṛghdhi ||
Translation: Forced by my love these many words I utter. Come near, and hold me in thy close embraces.

Sanskit Text: न वा उ ते तन्वा तन्वं सं पप्र्च्यां पापमाहुर्यःस्वसारं निगछात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na vā u te tanvā tanvaṃ saṃ papṛcyāṃ pāpamāhuryaḥsvasāraṃ nighachāt |
Translation: 12 I will not fold mine arms about thy body: they call it sin when one comes near his sister.

Sanskit Text: अन्येन मत परमुदः कल्पयस्व न तेभ्रात सुभगे वष्ट्येतत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anyena mat pramudaḥ kalpayasva na tebhrāta subhaghe vaṣṭyetat ||
Translation: Not me,—prepare thy pleasures with another: thy brother seeks not this from thee, O fair one.

Sanskit Text: बतो बतसि यम नैव ते मनो हर्दयं चाविदाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bato batasi yama naiva te mano hṛdayaṃ cāvidāma |
Translation: 13 Alas! thou art indeed a weakling, Yama we find in thee no trace of heart or spirit.

Sanskit Text: अन्या किलत्वां कक्ष्येव युक्तं परि षवजाते लिबुजेव वर्क्षम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anyā kilatvāṃ kakṣyeva yuktaṃ pari ṣvajāte libujeva vṛkṣam ||
Translation: As round the tree the woodbine clings, another will cling albout thee girt as with a girdle.

Sanskit Text: अन्यमू षु तवं यम्यन्य उ तवां परि षवजाते लिबुजेवव्र्क्षम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anyamū ṣu tvaṃ yamyanya u tvāṃ pari ṣvajāte libujevavṛkṣam |
Translation: 14 Embrace another, Yami; let another, even as the woodbine rings the tree, enfold thee.

Sanskit Text: तस्य वा तवं मन इछा स वा तवाधा कर्णुष्वसंविदं सुभद्राम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya vā tvaṃ mana ichā sa vā tavādhā kṛṇuṣvasaṃvidaṃ subhadrām ||
Translation: Win thou his heart and let him win thy fancy, and he shall form with thee a blest alliance.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा वर्ष्णे दुदुहे दोहसा दिवः पयांसि यह्वो अदितेरदाभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā vṛṣṇe duduhe dohasā divaḥ payāṃsi yahvo aditeradābhyaḥ |
Translation: 1. THE Bull hath yielded for the Bull the milk of heaven: the Son of Aditi can never be deceived.

Sanskit Text: विश्वं स वेद वरुणो यथा धिया सयज्ञियो यजतु यज्ञियान रतून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvaṃ sa veda varuṇo yathā dhiyā sayajñiyo yajatu yajñiyān ṛtūn ||
Translation: According to his wisdom Varuṇa knoweth all: may he, the Holy, hallow times for sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: रपद गन्धर्वीरप्या च योषणा नदस्य नादे परि पातुमे मनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rapad ghandharvīrapyā ca yoṣaṇā nadasya nāde pari pātume manaḥ |
Translation: 2 Gandharvi spake: may she, the Lady of the flood, amid the river's roaring leave my heart untouched.

Sanskit Text: इष्टस्य मध्ये अदितिर्नि धातु नो भराता नोज्येष्ठः परथमो वि वोचति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣṭasya madhye aditirni dhātu no bhrātā nojyeṣṭhaḥ prathamo vi vocati ||
Translation: May Aditi accomplish all that we desire, and may our eldest Brother tell us this as Chief.

Sanskit Text: सो चिन नु भद्रा कषुमती यशस्वत्युषा उवास मनवेस्वर्वती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: so cin nu bhadrā kṣumatī yaśasvatyuṣā uvāsa manavesvarvatī |
Translation: 3 Yea, even this blessed Morning, rich in store of food, splendid, with heavenly lustre, hath shone out for man,

Sanskit Text: यदीमुशन्तमुशतामनु करतुमग्निंहोतारं विदथाय जीजनन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadīmuśantamuśatāmanu kratumaghniṃhotāraṃ vidathāya jījanan ||
Translation: Since they, as was the wish of yearning Gods, brought forth that yearning Agni for the assembly as the Priest.

Sanskit Text: अध तयं दरप्सं विभ्वं विचक्षणं विराभरदिषितः शयेनो अध्वरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha tyaṃ drapsaṃ vibhvaṃ vicakṣaṇaṃ virābharadiṣitaḥ śyeno adhvare |
Translation: 4 And the fleet Falcon brought for sacrifice from afar this flowing Drop most excellent and keen of sight,

Sanskit Text: यदी विशो वर्णते दस्ममार्याग्निं होतारमध धीरजायत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadī viśo vṛṇate dasmamāryāaghniṃ hotāramadha dhīrajāyata ||
Translation: Then when the Āryan tribes chose as Invoking Priest Agni the Wonder-Worker, and the hymn rose up.

Sanskit Text: सदासि रण्वो यवसेव पुष्यते होत्राभिरग्ने मनुषःस्वध्वरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadāsi raṇvo yavaseva puṣyate hotrābhiraghne manuṣaḥsvadhvaraḥ |
Translation: 5 Still art thou kind to him who feeds thee as with grass, and, skilled in sacrifice, offers thee holy gifts.

Sanskit Text: विप्रस्य वा यच्छशमान उक्थ्यं वाजंससवानुपयासि भूरिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viprasya vā yacchaśamāna ukthyaṃ vājaṃsasavānupayāsi bhūribhiḥ ||
Translation: When thou, having received the sage's strengthening food with lauds, after long toil, cornest with many more.

Sanskit Text: उदीरय पितरा जार आ भगमियक्षति हर्यतो हर्त्तैष्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udīraya pitarā jāra ā bhaghamiyakṣati haryato hṛttaiṣyati |
Translation: 6 Urge thou thy Parents, as a lover ' to delight: the Lovely One desires and craves it from his heart.

Sanskit Text: विवक्ति वह्निः सवपस्यते मखस्तविष्यते असुरोवेपते मती ||
