Sanskrit Transliteration: vivakti vahniḥ svapasyate makhastaviṣyate asurovepate matī ||
Translation: The priest calls out, the sacrificer shows his skill, the Asura tries his strength, and with the hymn is stirred.

Sanskit Text: यस्ते अग्ने सुमतिं मर्तो अक्षत सहसः सूनो अति स परश्र्ण्वे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaste aghne sumatiṃ marto akṣat sahasaḥ sūno ati sa praśṛṇve |
Translation: 7 Far-famed is he, the mortal man, O Agni, thou Son of Strength, who hath obtained thy favour.

Sanskit Text: इषं दधानो वहमानो अश्वैरा स दयुमानमवान भूषति दयून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣaṃ dadhāno vahamāno aśvairā sa dyumānamavān bhūṣati dyūn ||
Translation: He, gathering power, borne onward by his horses, makes his days lovely in his might and splendour.

Sanskit Text: यदग्न एषा समितिर्भवाति देवी देवेषु यजता यजत्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadaghna eṣā samitirbhavāti devī deveṣu yajatā yajatra |
Translation: 8 When, Holy Agni, the divine assembly, the sacred synod mid the Gods, is gathered,

Sanskit Text: रत्ना च यद विभजासि सवधावो भागं नो अत्र वसुमन्तंवीतात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ratnā ca yad vibhajāsi svadhāvo bhāghaṃ no atra vasumantaṃvītāt ||
Translation: And when thou, Godlike One, dealest forth treasures, vouchsafe us, too, our portion of the riches.

Sanskit Text: शरुधी नो अग्ने सदने सधस्थे युक्ष्वा रथमम्र्तस्यद्रवित्नुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrudhī no aghne sadane sadhasthe yukṣvā rathamamṛtasyadravitnum |
Translation: 9 Hear us, O Agni, in your common dwelling: harness thy rapid car of Amṛta.

Sanskit Text: आ नो वह रोदसी देवपुत्रे माकिर्देवानामपभूरिह सयाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no vaha rodasī devaputre mākirdevānāmapabhūriha syāḥ ||
Translation: Bring Heaven and Earth, the Deities' Parents, hither: stay with us here, nor from the Gods be distant.

Sanskit Text: युजे वां बरह्म पूर्व्यं नमोभिर्वि शलोक एतु पथ्येवसूरेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuje vāṃ brahma pūrvyaṃ namobhirvi śloka etu pathyevasūreḥ |
Translation: 1. I YOKE with prayer your ancient inspiration: may the laud rise as on the prince's pathway.

Sanskit Text: शर्ण्वन्तु विश्वे अम्र्तस्य पुत्रा आ ये धामानिदिव्यानि तस्थुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇvantu viśve amṛtasya putrā ā ye dhāmānidivyāni tasthuḥ ||
Translation: All Sons of Immortality shall hear it, all the possessors of celestial natures.

Sanskit Text: यमे इव यतमाने यदैतं पर वां भरन मानुषादेवयन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yame iva yatamāne yadaitaṃ pra vāṃ bharan mānuṣādevayantaḥ |
Translation: 2 When speeding ye came nigh us like twin sisters, religious-hearted votaries brought you forward.

Sanskit Text: आ सीदतं सवमु लोकं विदाने सवासस्थेभवतमिन्दवे नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā sīdataṃ svamu lokaṃ vidāne svāsasthebhavatamindave naḥ ||
Translation: Take your place, ye who know your proper station: be near, be very near unto our Soma.

Sanskit Text: पञ्च पदानि रुपो अन्वरोहं चतुष्पदीमन्वेमि वरतेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pañca padāni rupo anvarohaṃ catuṣpadīmanvemi vratena |
Translation: 3 Five paces have I risen from Earth. I follow her who hath four feet with devout observance.

Sanskit Text: अक्षरेण परति मिम एतां रतस्य नाभावधि सं पुनामि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: akṣareṇa prati mima etāṃ ṛtasya nābhāvadhi saṃ punāmi ||
Translation: This by the Sacred Syllable have I measured: I purify in the central place of Order,

Sanskit Text: देवेभ्यः कमव्र्णीत मर्त्युं परजायै कमम्र्तंनाव्र्णीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devebhyaḥ kamavṛṇīta mṛtyuṃ prajāyai kamamṛtaṃnāvṛṇīta |
Translation: 4 He, for God's sake, chose death to be his portion. He chose not, for men's good, a life eternal

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिं यज्ञमक्र्ण्वत रषिं परियांयमस्तन्वं परारिरेचीत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiṃ yajñamakṛṇvata ṛṣiṃ priyāṃyamastanvaṃ prārirecīt ||
Translation: They sacrificed Bṛhaspati the Ṛṣi. Yama delivered up his own dear body.

Sanskit Text: सप्त कषरन्ति शिशवे मरुत्वते पित्रे पुत्रासो अप्यवीवतन्न्र्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sapta kṣaranti śiśave marutvate pitre putrāso apyavīvatannṛtam |
Translation: 5 The Seven flow to the Youth on whom the Maruts wait: the Sons unto the Father brought the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: उभे इदस्योभयस्य राजत उभे यतेते उभयस्यपुष्यतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhe idasyobhayasya rājata ubhe yatete ubhayasyapuṣyataḥ ||
Translation: Both these are his, as his they are the Lords of both: both toil; belonging unto both they prosper well.

Sanskit Text: उदीरतामवर उत परास उन मध्यमाः पितरःसोम्यासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udīratāmavara ut parāsa un madhyamāḥ pitaraḥsomyāsaḥ |
Translation: 1. MAY they ascend, the lowest, highest, midmost, the Fathers who deserve a share of Soma-

Sanskit Text: असुं य ईयुरव्र्का रतज्ञास्ते नो.अवन्तुपितरो हवेषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asuṃ ya īyuravṛkā ṛtajñāste no.avantupitaro haveṣu ||
Translation: May they who have attained the life of spirits, gentle and righteous, aid us when we call them.

Sanskit Text: इदं पित्र्भ्यो नमो अस्त्वद्य ये पूर्वासो य उपरास ईयुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ pitṛbhyo namo astvadya ye pūrvāso ya uparāsa īyuḥ |
Translation: 2 Now let us pay this homage to the Fathers, to those who passed of old and those who followed,

Sanskit Text: ये पार्थिवे रजस्या निषत्ता ये वा नूनं सुव्र्जनासुविक्षु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye pārthive rajasyā niṣattā ye vā nūnaṃ suvṛjanāsuvikṣu ||
Translation: Those who have rested in the earthly region, and those who dwell among the Mighty Races.

Sanskit Text: आहं पितॄन सुविदत्रानवित्सि नपातं च विक्रमणं चविष्णोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āhaṃ pitṝn suvidatrānavitsi napātaṃ ca vikramaṇaṃ caviṣṇoḥ |
Translation: 3 1 have attained the gracious-minded Fathers, I have gained son and progeny from Viṣṇu.

Sanskit Text: बर्हिषदो ये सवधया सुतस्य भजन्त पित्वस्तैहागमिष्ठाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: barhiṣado ye svadhayā sutasya bhajanta pitvastaihāghamiṣṭhāḥ ||
Translation: They who enjoy pressed juices with oblation seated on sacred grass, come oftenest hither.

Sanskit Text: बर्हिषदः पितर ऊत्यर्वागिमा वो हव्या चक्र्मा जुषध्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: barhiṣadaḥ pitara ūtyarvāghimā vo havyā cakṛmā juṣadhvam |
Translation: 4 Fathers who sit on sacred grass, come, help us: these offerings have we made for you; accept them.

Sanskit Text: त आ गतावसा शन्तमेनाथा नः शं योररपोदधात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta ā ghatāvasā śantamenāthā naḥ śaṃ yorarapodadhāta ||
Translation: So come to us with most auspicious favour, and give us health and strength without a trouble.

Sanskit Text: उपहूताः पितरः सोम्यासो बर्हिष्येषु निधिषु परियेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upahūtāḥ pitaraḥ somyāso barhiṣyeṣu nidhiṣu priyeṣu |
Translation: 5 May they, the Fathers, worthy of the Soma, invited to their favourite oblations.

Sanskit Text: त आ गमन्तु त इह शरुवन्त्वधि बरुवन्तु ते.अवन्त्वस्मान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta ā ghamantu ta iha śruvantvadhi bruvantu te.avantvasmān ||
Translation: Laid on the sacred grass, come nigh and listen: may they be gracious unto us and bless us.

Sanskit Text: आच्या जानु दक्षिणतो निषद्येमं यज्ञमभि गर्णीतविश्वे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ācyā jānu dakṣiṇato niṣadyemaṃ yajñamabhi ghṛṇītaviśve |
Translation: 6 Bowing your bended knees and seated southward, accept this sacrifice of ours with favour.

Sanskit Text: मा हिंसिष्ट पितरः केन चिन नो यद व आगःपुरुषता कराम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā hiṃsiṣṭa pitaraḥ kena cin no yad va āghaḥpuruṣatā karāma ||
Translation: Punish us not for any sin, O Fathers, which we through human frailty have committed.

Sanskit Text: आसीनासो अरुणीनामुपस्थे रयिं धत्त दाशुषे मर्त्याय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsīnāso aruṇīnāmupasthe rayiṃ dhatta dāśuṣe martyāya |
Translation: 7 Lapped in the bosom of the purple Mornings, give riches to the man who brings oblations.

Sanskit Text: पुत्रेभ्यः पितरस्तस्य वस्वः पर यछत त इहोर्जन्दधात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: putrebhyaḥ pitarastasya vasvaḥ pra yachata ta ihorjandadhāta ||
Translation: Grant to your sons a portion of that treasure, and, present, give them energy, ye Fathers.

Sanskit Text: ये नः पूर्वे पितरः सोम्यासो.अनूहिरे सोमपीथंवसिष्ठाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ somyāso.anūhire somapīthaṃvasiṣṭhāḥ |
Translation: 8 Our ancient Fathers who deserve the Soma, who came, most noble, to our Soma banquet,—

Sanskit Text: तेभिर्यमः संरराणो हवींष्युशन्नुशद्भिः परतिकाममत्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tebhiryamaḥ saṃrarāṇo havīṃṣyuśannuśadbhiḥ pratikāmamattu ||
Translation: With these let Yama, yearning with the yearning, rejoicing eat our offerings at his pleasure.

Sanskit Text: ये तात्र्षुर्देवत्रा जेहमाना होत्राविद सतोमतष्टासोर्कैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye tātṛṣurdevatrā jehamānā hotrāvida stomataṣṭāsoarkaiḥ |
Translation: 9 Come to us, Agni, with the gracioug Fathers who dwell in glowing light, the very Kavyas,

Sanskit Text: आग्ने याहि सुविदत्रेभिरर्वां सत्यैः कव्यैःपित्र्भिर्घर्मसद्भिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āghne yāhi suvidatrebhirarvāṃ satyaiḥ kavyaiḥpitṛbhirgharmasadbhiḥ ||
Translation: Who thirsted mid the Gods, who hasten hither, oblation winners, theme of singers' praises.

Sanskit Text: ये सत्यासो हविरदो हविष्पा इद्रेण देवैः सरथन्दधानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye satyāso havirado haviṣpā idreṇa devaiḥ sarathandadhānāḥ |
Translation: 10 Come, Agni, come with countless ancient Fathers, dwellers in light, primeval, God-adorers,

Sanskit Text: आग्ने याहि सहस्रं देववन्दैः परैःपूर्वैः पित्र्भिर्घर्मसद्भिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āghne yāhi sahasraṃ devavandaiḥ paraiḥpūrvaiḥ pitṛbhirgharmasadbhiḥ ||
Translation: Eaters and drinkers of oblations, truthful, who travel with the Deities and Indra.

Sanskit Text: अग्निष्वात्ताः पितर एह गछत सदः-सदः सदतसुप्रणीतयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṣvāttāḥ pitara eha ghachata sadaḥ-sadaḥ sadatasupraṇītayaḥ |
Translation: 11 Fathers whom Agni's flames have tasted, come ye nigh: ye kindly leaders, take ye each your proper place.

Sanskit Text: अत्ता हवींषि परयतानि बर्हिष्यथारयिं सर्ववीरं दधातन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: attā havīṃṣi prayatāni barhiṣyathārayiṃ sarvavīraṃ dadhātana ||
Translation: Eat sacrificial food presented on the grass: grant riches with a multitude of hero sons.

Sanskit Text: तवमग्न ईळितो जातवेदो.अवाड ढव्यानि सुरभीणिक्र्त्वी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaghna īḷito jātavedo.avāḍ ḍhavyāni surabhīṇikṛtvī |
Translation: 12 Thou, Agni Jātavedas, when entreated, didst bear the offerings which thou madest fragrant,

Sanskit Text: परादाः पित्र्भ्यः सवधया ते अक्षन्नद्धि तवन्देव परयता हवींषि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prādāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ svadhayā te akṣannaddhi tvandeva prayatā havīṃṣi ||
Translation: And give them to the Fathers who did cat them with Svadha. Eat, thou God, the gifts we bring thee.

Sanskit Text: ये चेह पितरो ये च नेह यांश्च विद्म यानु च नप्रविद्म |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye ceha pitaro ye ca neha yāṃśca vidma yānu ca napravidma |
Translation: 13 Thou, Jātavedas, knowest well the number of Fathers who are here and who are absent,

Sanskit Text: तवं वेत्थ यति ते जातवेदः सवधाभिर्यज्ञं सुक्र्तं जुषस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ vettha yati te jātavedaḥ svadhābhiryajñaṃ sukṛtaṃ juṣasva ||
Translation: Of Fathers whom we know and whom we know not: accept the sacrifice wellprepared with portions.

Sanskit Text: ये अग्निदग्धा ये अनग्निदग्धा मध्ये दिवः सवधयामादयन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye aghnidaghdhā ye anaghnidaghdhā madhye divaḥ svadhayāmādayante |
Translation: 14 They who, consumed by fire or not cremated, joy in their offering in the midst of heaven,—

Sanskit Text: तेभिः सवराळ असुनीतिमेतां यथावशन्तन्वं कल्पयस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tebhiḥ svarāḷ asunītimetāṃ yathāvaśantanvaṃ kalpayasva ||
Translation: Grant them, O Sovran Lord, the world of spirits and their own body, as thy pleasure wills it.

Sanskit Text: मैनमग्ने वि दहो माभि शोचो मास्य तवचं चिक्षिपो माशरीरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mainamaghne vi daho mābhi śoco māsya tvacaṃ cikṣipo māśarīram |
Translation: 1. Burn him not up, nor quite consume him, Agni: let not his body or his skin be scattered.

Sanskit Text: यदा शर्तं कर्णवो जातवेदो.अथेमेनं परहिणुतात पित्र्भ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā śṛtaṃ kṛṇavo jātavedo.athemenaṃ prahiṇutāt pitṛbhyaḥ ||
Translation: O Jātavedas, when thou hast matured him, then send him on his way unto the Fathers.

Sanskit Text: शर्तं यदा करसि जातवेदो.अथेमेनं परि दत्तात्पित्र्भ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛtaṃ yadā karasi jātavedo.athemenaṃ pari dattātpitṛbhyaḥ |
Translation: 2 When thou hast made him ready, Jātavedas, then do thou give him over to the Fathers.

Sanskit Text: यदा गछात्यसुनीतिमेतामथा देवानांवशनीर्भवाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā ghachātyasunītimetāmathā devānāṃvaśanīrbhavāti ||
Translation: When he attains unto the life that waits him, he shall become the Deities' controller.

Sanskit Text: सूर्यं चक्षुर्गछतु वातमात्मा दयां च गछप्र्थिवीं च धर्मणा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūryaṃ cakṣurghachatu vātamātmā dyāṃ ca ghachapṛthivīṃ ca dharmaṇā |
Translation: 3 The Sun receive thine eye, tne Wind thy spirit; go, as thy merit is, to earth or heaven.

Sanskit Text: अपो वा गछ यदि तत्र ते हितमोषधीषु परति तिष्ठा शरीरैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apo vā ghacha yadi tatra te hitamoṣadhīṣu prati tiṣṭhā śarīraiḥ ||
Translation: Go, if it be thy lot, unto the waters; go, make thine home in plants with all thy members.

Sanskit Text: अजो भागस्तपसा तं तपस्व तं ते शोचिस्तपतु तं तेर्चिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajo bhāghastapasā taṃ tapasva taṃ te śocistapatu taṃ tearciḥ |
Translation: 4 Thy portion is the goat: with heat consume him: let thy fierce flame, thy glowing splendour, burn him

Sanskit Text: यास्ते शिवास्तन्वो जातवेदस्ताभिर्वहैनंसुक्र्तामु लोकम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāste śivāstanvo jātavedastābhirvahainaṃsukṛtāmu lokam ||
Translation: With thine auspicious forms, o Jātavedas, bear this man to the region of the pious.

Sanskit Text: अव सर्ज पुनरग्ने पित्र्भ्यो यस्त आहुतश्चरतिस्वधाभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava sṛja punaraghne pitṛbhyo yasta āhutaścaratisvadhābhiḥ |
Translation: 5 Again, O Agni, to the Fathers send him who, offered in thee, goes with our oblations.

Sanskit Text: अयुर्वसान उप वेतु शेषः सं गछतान्तन्वा जातवेदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayurvasāna upa vetu śeṣaḥ saṃ ghachatāntanvā jātavedaḥ ||
Translation: Wearing new life let him increase his offspring: let him rejoin a body, Jātavedas.

Sanskit Text: यत ते कर्ष्णः शकुन आतुतोद पिपीलः सर्प उत वाश्वापदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te kṛṣṇaḥ śakuna ātutoda pipīlaḥ sarpa uta vāśvāpadaḥ |
Translation: 6 What wound soe’er the dark bird hath inflicted, the emmet, or the serpent, or the jackal,

Sanskit Text: अग्निष टद विश्वादगदं कर्णोतु सोमश्च योब्राह्मणानाविवेश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṣ ṭad viśvādaghadaṃ kṛṇotu somaśca yobrāhmaṇānāviveśa ||
Translation: May Agni who devoureth all things heal it and Soma who hath passed into the Brahmans.

Sanskit Text: अग्नेर्वर्म परि गोभिर्व्ययस्व सं परोर्णुष्व पीवसामेदसा च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnervarma pari ghobhirvyayasva saṃ prorṇuṣva pīvasāmedasā ca |
Translation: 7 Shield thee with flesh against the flames of Agni, encompass thee about with fat and marrow,

Sanskit Text: नेत तवा धर्ष्णुर्हरसा जर्ह्र्षाणो दध्र्ग्विधक्ष्यन पर्यङखयाते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: net tvā dhṛṣṇurharasā jarhṛṣāṇo dadhṛghvidhakṣyan paryaṅkhayāte ||
Translation: So will the Bold One, eager to attack thee with fierce glow fail to girdle and consume thee.

Sanskit Text: इममग्ने चमसं मा वि जिह्वरः परियो देवानामुतसोम्यानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imamaghne camasaṃ mā vi jihvaraḥ priyo devānāmutasomyānām |
Translation: 8 Forbear, O Agni, to upset this ladle: the Gods and they who merit Soma love it.

Sanskit Text: एष यश्चमसो देवपानस्तस्मिन देवा अम्र्तामादयन्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣa yaścamaso devapānastasmin devā amṛtāmādayante ||
Translation: This ladle, this which serves the Gods to drink from, in this the Immortal Deities rejoice them.

Sanskit Text: करव्यादमग्निं पर हिणोमि दूरं यमराज्ञो गछतुरिप्रवाहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kravyādamaghniṃ pra hiṇomi dūraṃ yamarājño ghachaturipravāhaḥ |
Translation: 9 1 send afar flesh eating Agni, bearing off stains may he depart to Yama's subjects.

Sanskit Text: इहैवायमितरो जातवेदा देवेभ्यो हव्यंवहतु परजानन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ihaivāyamitaro jātavedā devebhyo havyaṃvahatu prajānan ||
Translation: But let this other Jātavedas carry oblation to the Gods, for he is skilful.

Sanskit Text: यो अग्निः करव्यात परविवेश वो गर्हमिमं पश्यन्नितरंजातवेदसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo aghniḥ kravyāt praviveśa vo ghṛhamimaṃ paśyannitaraṃjātavedasam |
Translation: 10 I choose as God for Father-worship Agni, flesh-eater, who hath past within your dwelling,

Sanskit Text: तं हरामि पित्र्यज्ञाय देवं स घर्ममिन्वात परमे सधस्थे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ harāmi pitṛyajñāya devaṃ sa gharmaminvāt parame sadhasthe ||
Translation: While looking on this other Jātavedas. Let him light flames in the supreme assembly.

Sanskit Text: यो अग्निः करव्यवाहनः पितॄन यक्षद रताव्र्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo aghniḥ kravyavāhanaḥ pitṝn yakṣad ṛtāvṛdhaḥ |
Translation: 11 With offerings meet let Agni bring the Fathers who support the Law.

Sanskit Text: परेदुहव्यानि वोचति देवेभ्यश्च पित्र्भ्य आ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: preduhavyāni vocati devebhyaśca pitṛbhya ā ||
Translation: Let him announce oblations paid to Fathers and to Deities.

Sanskit Text: उशन्तस्त्वा नि धीमह्युशन्तः समिधीमहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uśantastvā ni dhīmahyuśantaḥ samidhīmahi |
Translation: 12 Right gladly would we set thee down, right gladly make thee burn and glow.

Sanskit Text: उशन्नुशत आ वह पितॄन हविषे अत्तवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uśannuśata ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave ||
Translation: Gladly bring yearning Fathers nigh to cat the food of sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: यं तवमग्ने समदहस्तमु निर्वापया पुनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ tvamaghne samadahastamu nirvāpayā punaḥ |
Translation: 13 Cool, Agni, and again refresh the spot which thou hast scorched and burnt.

Sanskit Text: कियाम्ब्वत्र रोहतु पाकदूर्वा वयल्कशा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kiyāmbvatra rohatu pākadūrvā vyalkaśā ||
Translation: Here let the water-lily grow, and tender grass and leafy herb.

Sanskit Text: शीतिके शीतिकावति हलादिके हलादिकावति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śītike śītikāvati hlādike hlādikāvati |
Translation: 14 O full of coolness, thou cool Plant, full of fresh moisture, freshening Herb,

Sanskit Text: मण्डूक्या सुसं गम इमं सवग्निं हर्षय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maṇḍūkyā susaṃ ghama imaṃ svaghniṃ harṣaya ||
Translation: Come hither with the female frog: fill with delight this Agni here.

Sanskit Text: तवष्टा दुहित्रे वहतुं कर्णोतीतीदं विश्वं भुवनंसमेति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṣṭā duhitre vahatuṃ kṛṇotītīdaṃ viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃsameti |
Translation: 1. TVASTAR prepares the bridal of his Daughter: all the world hears the tidings and assembles.

Sanskit Text: यमस्य माता पर्युह्यमाना महो जाया विवस्वतोननाश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamasya mātā paryuhyamānā maho jāyā vivasvatonanāśa ||
Translation: But Yama's Mother, Spouse of great Vivasvān, vanished as she was carried to her dwelling.

Sanskit Text: अपागूहन्नम्र्तां मर्त्येभ्यः कर्त्वी सवर्णामददुर्विवस्वते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāghūhannamṛtāṃ martyebhyaḥ kṛtvī savarṇāmadadurvivasvate |
Translation: 2 From mortal men they hid the Immortal Lady, made one like her and gave her to Vivasvān.

Sanskit Text: उताश्विनावभरद यत तदसीदजहादु दवामिथुना सरण्यूः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utāśvināvabharad yat tadasīdajahādu dvāmithunā saraṇyūḥ ||
Translation: Saranyu brought to him the Aśvin brothers, and then deserted both twinned pairs of children.

Sanskit Text: पूषा तवेतश्च्यावयतु पर विद्वाननष्टपशुर्भुवनस्य गोपाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūṣā tvetaścyāvayatu pra vidvānanaṣṭapaśurbhuvanasya ghopāḥ |
Translation: 3 Guard of the world, whose cattle ne’er are injured, may Pūṣan bear thee hence, for he hath knowledge.

Sanskit Text: स तवैतेभ्यः परि ददत पित्र्भ्यो.अग्निर्देवेभ्यः सुविदत्रियेभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvaitebhyaḥ pari dadat pitṛbhyo.aghnirdevebhyaḥ suvidatriyebhyaḥ ||
Translation: May he consign thee to these Fathers' keeping, and to the gracious Gods let Agni give thee.

Sanskit Text: आयुर्विश्वायुः परि पासति तवा पूषा तवा पातु परपथेपुरस्तात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āyurviśvāyuḥ pari pāsati tvā pūṣā tvā pātu prapathepurastāt |
Translation: 4 May Āyu, giver of all life, protect thee, and bear thee forward on the distant pathway.

Sanskit Text: यत्रसते सुक्र्तो यत्र ते ययुस्तत्र तवादेवः सविता दधातु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatrasate sukṛto yatra te yayustatra tvādevaḥ savitā dadhātu ||
Translation: Thither let Savitar the God transport thee, where dwell the pious who have passed-before thee.

Sanskit Text: पूषेमा आशा अनु वेद सर्वाः सो अस्मानभयतमेननेषत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūṣemā āśā anu veda sarvāḥ so asmānabhayatamenaneṣat |
Translation: 5 Pūṣan knows all these realms: may he conduct us by ways that are most free from fear and danger.

Sanskit Text: सवस्तिदा आघ्र्णिः सर्ववीरो.अप्रयुछन पुर एतुप्रजानन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svastidā āghṛṇiḥ sarvavīro.aprayuchan pura etuprajānan ||
Translation: Giver of blessings, glowing, all-heroic, may he, thewise and watchful, go before us.

Sanskit Text: परपथे पथमजनिष्ट पूषा परपथे दिवः परपथेप्र्थिव्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prapathe pathamajaniṣṭa pūṣā prapathe divaḥ prapathepṛthivyāḥ |
Translation: 6 Pūṣan was born to move on distant pathways, on the road far from earth and far from heaven.

Sanskit Text: उभे अभि परियतमे सधस्थे आ च परा चचरति परजानन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhe abhi priyatame sadhasthe ā ca parā cacarati prajānan ||
Translation: To both most wonted places of assembly he travels and returns with perfect knowledge.

Sanskit Text: सरस्वतीं देवयन्तो हवन्ते सरस्वतीमध्वरे तायमाने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarasvatīṃ devayanto havante sarasvatīmadhvare tāyamāne |
Translation: 7 The pious call Sarasvatī, they worship Sarasvatī while sacrifice proceedeth.

Sanskit Text: सरस्वतीं सुक्र्तो अह्वयन्त सरस्वती दाशुषे वार्यं दात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarasvatīṃ sukṛto ahvayanta sarasvatī dāśuṣe vāryaṃ dāt ||
Translation: The pious called Sarasvatī aforetime. Sarasvatī send bliss to him who giveth.

Sanskit Text: सरस्वति या सरथं ययथ सवधाभिर्देवि पित्र्भिर्मदन्ती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarasvati yā sarathaṃ yayatha svadhābhirdevi pitṛbhirmadantī |
Translation: 8 Sarasvatī, who camest with the Fathers, with them rejoicing thee in our oblations,

Sanskit Text: आसद्यास्मिन बर्हिषि मादयस्वानमीवा इष आधेह्यस्मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayasvānamīvā iṣa ādhehyasme ||
Translation: Seated upon this sacred grass be joyful, and give us strengthening food that brings no sickness.

Sanskit Text: सरस्वतीं यां पितरो हवन्ते दक्षिणा यज्ञमभिनक्षमाणाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarasvatīṃ yāṃ pitaro havante dakṣiṇā yajñamabhinakṣamāṇāḥ |
Translation: 9 Thou, called on as Sarasvatī by Fathers who come right forward to our solemn service,

Sanskit Text: सहस्रार्घमिळो अत्र भागं रायस्पोषं यजमानेषु धेहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasrārghamiḷo atra bhāghaṃ rāyaspoṣaṃ yajamāneṣu dhehi ||
Translation: Give food and wealth to present sacrificers, a portion, worth a thousand, of refreshment.

Sanskit Text: अपो अस्मान मातरः शुन्धयन्तु घर्तेन नो घर्तप्वः पुनन्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apo asmān mātaraḥ śundhayantu ghṛtena no ghṛtapvaḥ punantu |
Translation: 10 The Mother Floods shall make us bright and shining, cleansers of holy oil, with oil shall cleanse us:

Sanskit Text: विश्वं हि रिप्रं परवहन्ति देविरुदिदाभ्यः शुचिरापूत एमि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvaṃ hi ripraṃ pravahanti devirudidābhyaḥ śucirāpūta emi ||
Translation: For, Goddesses, they bear off all defilement: I, rise up from them purified and brightened.

Sanskit Text: दरप्सश्चस्कन्द परथमाननु दयूनिमं च योनिमनु यश्च पुर्वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: drapsaścaskanda prathamānanu dyūnimaṃ ca yonimanu yaśca purvaḥ |
Translation: 11 Through days of earliest date the Drop descended on this place and on that which was before it.

Sanskit Text: समानं योनिमनु संचरन्तं दरप्सं जुहोम्यनु सप्त होत्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samānaṃ yonimanu saṃcarantaṃ drapsaṃ juhomyanu sapta hotrāḥ ||
Translation: I offer up, throughout the seven oblations, the Drop which still to one same place is moving.

Sanskit Text: यस्ते दरप्स सकन्दति यस्ते अंशुर्बाहुच्युतो धिषणायाुपस्थात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaste drapsa skandati yaste aṃśurbāhucyuto dhiṣaṇāyāupasthāt |
Translation: 12 The Drop that falls, thy stalk which arms have shaken, which from the bosom of the press hath fallen,

Sanskit Text: अध्वर्योर्वा परि वा यः पवित्रात तं ते जुहोमिमनसा वषट्क्र्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhvaryorvā pari vā yaḥ pavitrāt taṃ te juhomimanasā vaṣaṭkṛtam ||
Translation: Or from the Adhvaryu's purifying filter, I offer thee with heart and cry of Vaṣaṭ!

Sanskit Text: यस्ते दरप्स सकन्नो यस्ते अंशुरवश्च यः परःस्रुचा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaste drapsa skanno yaste aṃśuravaśca yaḥ paraḥsrucā |
Translation: 13 That fallen Drop of thine, the stalk which from the ladle fell away,

Sanskit Text: अयं देवो बर्हस्पतिः सं तं सिञ्चतु राधसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ devo bṛhaspatiḥ saṃ taṃ siñcatu rādhase ||
Translation: This present God Bṛhaspati shall pour it forth to make us rich.

Sanskit Text: पयस्वतीरोषधयः पयस्वन मामकं वचः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: payasvatīroṣadhayaḥ payasvan māmakaṃ vacaḥ |
Translation: 14 The plants of earth are rich in milk, and rich in milk is this my speech;

Sanskit Text: अपाम्पयस्वदित पयस्तेन मा सह शुन्धत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāmpayasvadit payastena mā saha śundhata ||
Translation: And rich in milk the essence of the Waters: make me pure therewith.

Sanskit Text: परं मर्त्यो अनु परेहि पन्थां यस्ते सव इतरो देवयानात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: paraṃ mṛtyo anu parehi panthāṃ yaste sva itaro devayānāt |
Translation: 1. Go hence, O Death, pursue thy special pathway apart from that which Gods are wont to travel.

Sanskit Text: चक्षुष्मते शर्ण्वते ते बरवीमि मा नः परजां रीरिषोमोत वीरान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakṣuṣmate śṛṇvate te bravīmi mā naḥ prajāṃ rīriṣomota vīrān ||
Translation: To thee I say it who hast eyes and hearest: Touch not our offspring, injure not our heroes.

Sanskit Text: मर्त्योः पदं योपयन्तो यदैत दराघीय आयुः परतरन्दधानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mṛtyoḥ padaṃ yopayanto yadaita drāghīya āyuḥ pratarandadhānāḥ |
Translation: 2 As ye have come effacing Mrtyu's footstep, to further times prolonging your existence,

Sanskit Text: आप्यायमानाः परजया धनेन शुद्धाःपूता भवत यज्ञियासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpyāyamānāḥ prajayā dhanena śuddhāḥpūtā bhavata yajñiyāsaḥ ||
Translation: May ye be rich in children and possessions. cleansed, purified, and meet for sacrificing.

Sanskit Text: इमे जीवा वि मर्तैरावव्र्त्रन्नभूद भद्रा देवहूतिर्नोद्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime jīvā vi mṛtairāvavṛtrannabhūd bhadrā devahūtirnoadya |
Translation: 3 Divided from the dead are these, the living: now be our calling on the Gods successful.

Sanskit Text: पराञ्चो अगाम नर्तये हसाय दराघीय आयुःप्रतरं दधानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāñco aghāma nṛtaye hasāya drāghīya āyuḥprataraṃ dadhānāḥ ||
Translation: We have gone forth for dancing and for laughter, tofurther times prolonging our existence.

Sanskit Text: इमं जीवेभ्यः परिधिं दधामि मैषां नु गादपरोर्थमेतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ jīvebhyaḥ paridhiṃ dadhāmi maiṣāṃ nu ghādaparoarthametam |
Translation: 4 Here I erect this rampart for the living; let none of these, none other, reach this limit.

Sanskit Text: शतं जीवन्तु शरदः पुरूचीरन्तर्म्र्त्युं दधतां पर्वतेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ jīvantu śaradaḥ purūcīrantarmṛtyuṃ dadhatāṃ parvatena ||
Translation: May they survive a hundred lengthened autumns, and may they bury Death beneath this mountain.

Sanskit Text: यथाहान्यनुपूर्वं भवन्ति यथ रतव रतुभिर्यन्तिसाधु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathāhānyanupūrvaṃ bhavanti yatha ṛtava ṛtubhiryantisādhu |
Translation: 5 As the days follow days in close succession, as with the seasons duly come the seasons,

Sanskit Text: यथा न पूर्वमपरो जहात्येवा धातरायूंषि कल्पयैषाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā na pūrvamaparo jahātyevā dhātarāyūṃṣi kalpayaiṣām ||
Translation: As each successor fails not his foregoer, so form the lives of these, O great Ordainer.

Sanskit Text: आ रोहतायुर्जरसं वर्णाना अनुपूर्वं यतमाना यतिष्ठ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā rohatāyurjarasaṃ vṛṇānā anupūrvaṃ yatamānā yatiṣṭha |
Translation: 6 Live your full lives ap! find old age delightful, all of you striving one behind the other.

Sanskit Text: इह तवष्टा सुजनिमा सजोषा दीर्घमायुःकरति जीवसे वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iha tvaṣṭā sujanimā sajoṣā dīrghamāyuḥkarati jīvase vaḥ ||
Translation: May Tvaṣṭar, maker of fair things, be gracious and lengthen out the days of your existence.

Sanskit Text: इमा नारीरविधवाः सुपत्नीराञ्जनेन सर्पिषा संविशन्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā nārīravidhavāḥ supatnīrāñjanena sarpiṣā saṃviśantu |
Translation: 7 Let these unwidowed dames with noble husbands adorn themselves with fragrant balm and unguent.

Sanskit Text: अनश्रवो.अनमीवाः सुरत्ना आ रोहन्तु जनयोयोनिमग्रे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anaśravo.anamīvāḥ suratnā ā rohantu janayoyonimaghre ||
Translation: Decked with fair jewels, tearless, free from sorrow, first let the dames go up to where he lieth.

Sanskit Text: उदीर्ष्व नार्यभि जीवलोकं गतासुमेतमुप शेष एहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udīrṣva nāryabhi jīvalokaṃ ghatāsumetamupa śeṣa ehi |
Translation: 8 Rise, come unto the world of life, O woman: come, he is lifeless by whose side thou liest.

Sanskit Text: हस्तग्राभस्य दिधिषोस्तवेदं पत्युर्जनित्वमभि सम्बभूथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hastaghrābhasya didhiṣostavedaṃ patyurjanitvamabhi sambabhūtha ||
Translation: Wifehood with this thy husband was thy portion, who took thy hand and wooed thee as a lover.

Sanskit Text: धनुर्हस्तादाददानो मर्तस्यास्मे कषत्राय वर्चसेबलाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhanurhastādādadāno mṛtasyāsme kṣatrāya varcasebalāya |
Translation: 9 From his dead hand I take the bow be carried, that it may be our power and might and glory.

Sanskit Text: अत्रैव तवमिह वयं सुवीरा विश्वा सप्र्धोभिमातीर्जयेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atraiva tvamiha vayaṃ suvīrā viśvā spṛdhoabhimātīrjayema ||
Translation: There art thou, there; and here with noble heroes may we o’ercome all hosts that fight against us.

Sanskit Text: उप सर्प मातरं भूमिमेतामुरुव्यचसं पर्थिवींसुशेवाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa sarpa mātaraṃ bhūmimetāmuruvyacasaṃ pṛthivīṃsuśevām |
Translation: 10 Betake thee to the Iap of Earth the Mother, of Earth far-spreading, very kind and gracious.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्णम्रदा युवतिर्दक्षिणावत एषा तवा पातुनिरतेरुपस्थात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrṇamradā yuvatirdakṣiṇāvata eṣā tvā pātunirterupasthāt ||
Translation: Young Dame, wool-soft unto the guerdongiver, may she preserve thee from Destruction's bosom.

Sanskit Text: उच्छ्वञ्चस्व पर्थिवि मा नि बाधथाः सूपायनास्मै भवसूपवञ्चना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ucchvañcasva pṛthivi mā ni bādhathāḥ sūpāyanāsmai bhavasūpavañcanā |
Translation: 11 Heave thyself, Earth, nor press thee downward heavily: afford him easy access, gently tending him.

Sanskit Text: माता पुत्रं यथा सिचाभ्येनं भूमूर्णुहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mātā putraṃ yathā sicābhyenaṃ bhūmaūrṇuhi ||
Translation: Cover him, as a mother wraps her skirt about her child, O Earth.

Sanskit Text: उच्छ्वञ्चमाना पर्थिवी सु तिष्ठतु सहस्रं मित उप हिश्रयन्ताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ucchvañcamānā pṛthivī su tiṣṭhatu sahasraṃ mita upa hiśrayantām |
Translation: 12 Now let the heaving earth be free from motion: yea,—let a thousand clods remain above him.

Sanskit Text: ते गर्हासो घर्तश्चुतो भवन्तु विश्वाहास्मैशरणाः सन्त्वत्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te ghṛhāso ghṛtaścuto bhavantu viśvāhāsmaiśaraṇāḥ santvatra ||
Translation: Be they to him a home distilling fatness, here let them ever be his place of refuge.

Sanskit Text: उत ते सतभ्नामि पर्थिवीं तवत परीमं लोगं निदधन मोहं रिषम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut te stabhnāmi pṛthivīṃ tvat parīmaṃ loghaṃ nidadhan moahaṃ riṣam |
Translation: 13 I stay the earth from thee, while over thee I place this piece of earth. May I be free from injury.

Sanskit Text: एतां सथूणां पितरो धारयन्तु ते.अत्रायमः सादना ते मिनोतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: etāṃ sthūṇāṃ pitaro dhārayantu te.atrāyamaḥ sādanā te minotu ||
Translation: Here let the Fathers keep this pillar firm for thee, and there let Yama make thee an abiding-place.

Sanskit Text: परतीचीने मामहनीष्वाः पर्णमिवा दधुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratīcīne māmahanīṣvāḥ parṇamivā dadhuḥ |
Translation: 14 Even as an arrow's feathers, they have set me on a fitting day.

Sanskit Text: परतीचीं जग्रभा वाचमश्वं रशनया यथा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratīcīṃ jaghrabhā vācamaśvaṃ raśanayā yathā ||
Translation: The fit word have I caught and held as ’twere a courser with the rein.

Sanskit Text: नि वर्तध्वं मानु गातास्मान सिषक्त रेवतीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni vartadhvaṃ mānu ghātāsmān siṣakta revatīḥ |
Translation: 1. TURN, go not farther on your way: visit us, O ye Wealthy Ones.

Sanskit Text: अग्नीषोमापुनर्वसू अस्मे धारयतं रयिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnīṣomāpunarvasū asme dhārayataṃ rayim ||
Translation: Agni and Soma, ye who bring riches again, secure us wealth.

Sanskit Text: पुनरेना नि वर्तय पुनरेना नया कुरु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: punarenā ni vartaya punarenā nyā kuru |
Translation: 2 Make these return to us again, bring them beside us once again.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र एणा नियछत्वग्निरेना उपाजतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra eṇā niyachatvaghnirenā upājatu ||
Translation: May. Indra give them back to us, and Agni drive them hither-ward.

Sanskit Text: पुनरेता नि वर्तन्तामस्मिन पुष्यन्तु गोपतौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: punaretā ni vartantāmasmin puṣyantu ghopatau |
Translation: 3 Let them return to us again: under this herdsman let them feed.

Sanskit Text: इहैवाग्नेनि धारयेह तिष्ठतु या रयिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ihaivāghneni dhārayeha tiṣṭhatu yā rayiḥ ||
Translation: Do thou, O Agni, keep them here, and let the wealth we have remain.

Sanskit Text: यन नियानं नययनं संज्ञानं यत परायणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yan niyānaṃ nyayanaṃ saṃjñānaṃ yat parāyaṇam |
Translation: 4 1 call upon their herdsman, him who knoweth well their coming nigh,

Sanskit Text: आवर्तनं निवर्तनं यो गोपा अपि तं हुवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvartanaṃ nivartanaṃ yo ghopā api taṃ huve ||
Translation: Their parting and their home-return, and watcheth their approach and rest.

Sanskit Text: य उदानड वययनं य उदानट परायणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya udānaḍ vyayanaṃ ya udānaṭ parāyaṇam |
Translation: 5 Yea, let the herdsman, too, return, who marketh well their driving-forth;

Sanskit Text: आवर्तनंनिवर्तनमपि गोपा नि वर्तताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvartanaṃnivartanamapi ghopā ni vartatām ||
Translation: Marketh their wandering away, their turning back and coming home.

Sanskit Text: आ निवर्त नि वर्तय पुनर्न इन्द्र गा देहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā nivarta ni vartaya punarna indra ghā dehi |
Translation: 6 Home-leader, lead them home to us; Indra, restore to us our kine:

Sanskit Text: जीवाभिर्भुनजामहै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jīvābhirbhunajāmahai ||
Translation: We will rejoice in them alive.

Sanskit Text: परि वो विश्वतो दध ऊर्जा घर्तेन पयसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari vo viśvato dadha ūrjā ghṛtena payasā |
Translation: 7 1 offer you on every side butter and milk and strengthening food.

Sanskit Text: ये देवाः केच यज्ञियास्ते रय्या सं सर्जन्तु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye devāḥ keca yajñiyāste rayyā saṃ sṛjantu naḥ ||
Translation: May all the Holy Deities pour down on us a flood of wealth.

Sanskit Text: आ निवर्तन वर्तय नि निवर्तन वर्तय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā nivartana vartaya ni nivartana vartaya |
Translation: 8 O thou Home-leader, lead them home, restore them thou who bringest home.

Sanskit Text: भूम्याश्चतस्रःप्रदिशस्ताभ्य एना नि वर्तय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūmyāścatasraḥpradiśastābhya enā ni vartaya ||
Translation: Four are the quarters of the earth; from these bring back to us our kine,

Sanskit Text: भद्रं नो अपि वातय मनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadraṃ no api vātaya manaḥ ||
Translation: 1. SEND unto us a good and happy mind.

Sanskit Text: अग्निमीळे भुजां यविष्ठं शासा मित्रं दुर्धरीतुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnimīḷe bhujāṃ yaviṣṭhaṃ śāsā mitraṃ durdharītum |
Translation: 2 1 worship Agni, Youthfullest of Gods, resistless, Friend of laws;

Sanskit Text: यस्य धर्मन सवरेनीः सपर्यन्ति मातुरूधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya dharman svarenīḥ saparyanti māturūdhaḥ ||
Translation: Under whose guard and heavenly light the Spotted seek the Mother's breast:

Sanskit Text: यमासा कर्पनीळं भासाकेतुं वर्धयन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamāsā kṛpanīḷaṃ bhāsāketuṃ vardhayanti |
Translation: 3 Whom with their mouth they magnify, bannered with flame and homed in light.

Sanskit Text: भराजतेश्रेणिदन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhrājateśreṇidan ||
Translation: He glitters with his row of teeth.

Sanskit Text: अर्यो विशां गातुरेति पर यदानड दिवो अन्तान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aryo viśāṃ ghātureti pra yadānaḍ divo antān |
Translation: 4 Kind, Furtherer of men, he comes, when he hath reached the ends of heaven,

Sanskit Text: कविरभ्रं दिद्यानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kavirabhraṃ didyānaḥ ||
Translation: Sage, giving splendour to the clouds.

Sanskit Text: जुषद धव्या मानुषस्योर्ध्वस्तस्थाव रभ्वा यज्ञे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣad dhavyā mānuṣasyordhvastasthāv ṛbhvā yajñe |
Translation: 5 To taste man's offerings, he, the Strong, hath risen erect at sacrifice:

Sanskit Text: मिन्वन सद्म पुर एति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: minvan sadma pura eti ||
Translation: Fixing his dwelling he proceeds.

Sanskit Text: स हि कषेमो हविर्यज्ञः शरुष्टीदस्य गातुरेति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi kṣemo haviryajñaḥ śruṣṭīdasya ghātureti |
Translation: 6 Here are oblation, worship, rest: rapidly comes his furtherance.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं देवा वाशीमन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ devā vāśīmantam ||
Translation: To sword-armed Agni come the Gods.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञासाहं दुव इषे.अग्निं पूर्वस्य शेवस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñāsāhaṃ duva iṣe.aghniṃ pūrvasya śevasya |
Translation: 7 With service for chief bliss I seek the Lord of Sacrifice, Agni, whom

Sanskit Text: अद्रेःसूनुमायुमाहुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adreḥsūnumāyumāhuḥ ||
Translation: They call the Living, Son of Cloud.

Sanskit Text: नरो ये के चास्मदा विश्वेत ते वाम आ सयुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: naro ye ke cāsmadā viśvet te vāma ā syuḥ |
Translation: 8 Blest evermore be all the men who come from us, who magnify

Sanskit Text: अग्निंहविषा वर्धन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃhaviṣā vardhantaḥ ||
Translation: Agni with sacrificial gifts.

Sanskit Text: कर्ष्णः शवेतो.अरुषो यामो अस्य बरध्न रज्र उत शोणोयशस्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṣṇaḥ śveto.aruṣo yāmo asya bradhna ṛjra uta śoṇoyaśasvān |
Translation: 9 The path he treads is black and white and red, and striped, and brown, crimson, and glorious.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यरूपं जनिता जजान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyarūpaṃ janitā jajāna ||
Translation: His sire begat him bright with hues of gold.

Sanskit Text: एवा ते अग्ने विमदो मनीषामूर्जो नपादम्र्तेभिःसजोषाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā te aghne vimado manīṣāmūrjo napādamṛtebhiḥsajoṣāḥ |
Translation: 10 Thus with his thoughts, O Son of Strength, O Agni, hath Vimada, accordant with the Immortals,

Sanskit Text: गिर आ वक्षत सुमतीरियान इषमूर्जंसुक्षितिं विश्वमाभाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghira ā vakṣat sumatīriyāna iṣamūrjaṃsukṣitiṃ viśvamābhāḥ ||
Translation: Offered thee hymns, soliciting thy favour. Thou hast brought all food, strength, a prosperous dwelling.

Sanskit Text: आग्निं न सवव्र्क्तिभिर्होतारं तवा वर्णीमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āghniṃ na svavṛktibhirhotāraṃ tvā vṛṇīmahe |
Translation: 1. WITH offerings of our own we choose thee, Agni, as Invoking Priest,

Sanskit Text: यज्ञायस्तीर्णबर्हिषे वि वो मदे शीरं पावकशोचिषंविवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñāyastīrṇabarhiṣe vi vo made śīraṃ pāvakaśociṣaṃvivakṣase ||
Translation: For sacrifice with trimmed grass,—at your glad carouse-piercing and brightly shining. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: तवामु ते सवाभुवः शुम्भन्त्यश्वराधसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmu te svābhuvaḥ śumbhantyaśvarādhasaḥ |
Translation: 2 The wealthy ones adorn thee, they who bring us horses as their gift:

Sanskit Text: वेति तवामुपसेचनी वि वो मद रजीतिरग्न आहुतिर्विवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: veti tvāmupasecanī vi vo mada ṛjītiraghna āhutirvivakṣase ||
Translation: The sprinkling ladle, Agni,—at your glad carouse -and glowing offering taste thee. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: तवे धर्माण आसते जुहूभिः सिञ्चतीरिव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve dharmāṇa āsate juhūbhiḥ siñcatīriva |
Translation: 3 The holy statutes rest by thee, as ’twere with ladles that o’erflow.

Sanskit Text: कर्ष्णारूपाण्यर्जुना वि वो मदे विश्वा अधि शरियो धिषेविवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṣṇārūpāṇyarjunā vi vo made viśvā adhi śriyo dhiṣevivakṣase ||
Translation: Black and white-gleaming colours,—at your glad carouse-all glories thou assurnest. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: यमग्ने मन्यसे रयिं सहसावन्नमर्त्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamaghne manyase rayiṃ sahasāvannamartya |
Translation: 4 O Agni, what thou deemest wealth, Victorious and Immortal One!

Sanskit Text: तमा नोवाजसातये वि वो मदे यज्ञेषु चित्रमा भरा विवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamā novājasātaye vi vo made yajñeṣu citramā bharā vivakṣase ||
Translation: Bring thou to give us vigour,—at your glad carouse -splendid at sacrifices. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्जातो अथर्वणा विदद विश्वानि काव्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirjāto atharvaṇā vidad viśvāni kāvyā |
Translation: 5 Skilled in all lore is Agni, he whom erst Atharvan brought to life.

Sanskit Text: भुवद दूतोविवस्वतो वि वो मदे परियो यमस्य काम्यो विवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhuvad dūtovivasvato vi vo made priyo yamasya kāmyo vivakṣase ||
Translation: He was Vivasvān's envoy, at your glad carouse-the weIl-loved friend of Yama, Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: तवां यज्ञेष्वीळते.अग्ने परयत्यध्वरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ yajñeṣvīḷate.aghne prayatyadhvare |
Translation: 6 At sacrifices they adore thee, Agni, when the rite proceeds.

Sanskit Text: तवं वसूनिकाम्या वि वो मदे विश्वा दधासि दाशुषे विवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ vasūnikāmyā vi vo made viśvā dadhāsi dāśuṣe vivakṣase ||
Translation: All fair and lovely treasures-at your glad carouse-thou givest him who offers. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: तवां यज्ञेष्व रत्विजं चारुमग्ने नि षेदिरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ yajñeṣv ṛtvijaṃ cārumaghne ni ṣedire |
Translation: 7 Men, Agni, have established thee as welcome Priest at holy rites,

Sanskit Text: घर्तप्रतीकं मनुषो वि वो मदे शुक्रं चेतिष्ठमक्षभिर्विवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtapratīkaṃ manuṣo vi vo made śukraṃ cetiṣṭhamakṣabhirvivakṣase ||
Translation: Thee whose face shines with butter,—at your glad carouse-bright, with eyes most observant. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने शुक्रेण शोचिषोरु परथयसे बर्हत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne śukreṇa śociṣoru prathayase bṛhat |
Translation: 8 Wide and aloft thou spreadest thee, O Agni, with thy brilliant flame.

Sanskit Text: अभिक्रन्दन्व्र्षायसे वि वो मदे गर्भं दधासि जामिषु विवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhikrandanvṛṣāyase vi vo made gharbhaṃ dadhāsi jāmiṣu vivakṣase ||
Translation: A Bull art thou when bellowing,—at your glad carouse-thou dost impregn the Sisters. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: कुह शरुत इन्द्रः कस्मिन्नद्य जने मित्रो न शरुयते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kuha śruta indraḥ kasminnadya jane mitro na śruyate |
Translation: 1. WHERE is famed Indra heard of? With what folk is he renowned to-day as Mitra is,—

Sanskit Text: रषीणां वा यः कषये गुहा व चर्क्र्षे गिर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṣīṇāṃ vā yaḥ kṣaye ghuhā va carkṛṣe ghira ||
Translation: Who in the home of Ṛṣis and in secret is extolled with song?

Sanskit Text: इह शरुत इन्द्रो अस्मे अद्य सतवे वज्र्य रचीषमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iha śruta indro asme adya stave vajry ṛcīṣamaḥ |
Translation: 2 Even here is Indra famed, and among us this day the glorious Thunderer is praised,

Sanskit Text: मित्रो नयो जनेष्वा यशश्चक्रे असाम्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitro nayo janeṣvā yaśaścakre asāmyā ||
Translation: He who like Mitra mid the folk hath won complete and full renown.

Sanskit Text: महो यस पतिः शवसो असाम्या महो नर्म्णस्य तूतुजिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: maho yas patiḥ śavaso asāmyā maho nṛmṇasya tūtujiḥ |
Translation: 3 He who is Sovran Lord of great and perfect strength, exerter of heroic might,

Sanskit Text: भर्ता वज्रस्य धर्ष्णोः पिता पुत्रमिव परियम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhartā vajrasya dhṛṣṇoḥ pitā putramiva priyam ||
Translation: Who bears the fearless thunder as a father bears his darling son.

Sanskit Text: युजानो अश्व वातस्य धुनी देवो देवस्य वज्रिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yujāno aśva vātasya dhunī devo devasya vajrivaḥ |
Translation: 4 Harnessing to thy car, as God, two blustering Steeds Of the Wind-God, O Thunderer,

Sanskit Text: सयन्तपथा विरुक्मता सर्जान सतोष्यध्वनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: syantapathā virukmatā sṛjāna stoṣyadhvanaḥ ||
Translation: That speed along the shining path, thou making ways art glorified.

Sanskit Text: तवं तया चिद वातस्याश्वागा रज्रा तमना वहध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tyā cid vātasyāśvāghā ṛjrā tmanā vahadhyai |
Translation: 5 Even to these dark Steeds of Wind thou of thyself hast come to ride,

Sanskit Text: ययोर्देवो न मर्त्यो यन्ता नकिर्विदाय्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayordevo na martyo yantā nakirvidāyyaḥ ||
Translation: Of which no driver may be found, none, be he God or mortal man.

Sanskit Text: अध गमन्तोशना पर्छते वां कदर्था न आ गर्हम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha ghmantośanā pṛchate vāṃ kadarthā na ā ghṛham |
Translation: 6 When ye approach, men ask you, thee and Uśanā: Why come ye to our dwelling-place?

Sanskit Text: आजग्मथुः पराकाद दिवश्च गमश्च मर्त्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ājaghmathuḥ parākād divaśca ghmaśca martyam ||
Translation: Why are ye come to mortal man from distant realms of eapth and heaven?

Sanskit Text: आ न इन्द्र पर्क्षसे.अस्माकं बरह्मोद्यतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā na indra pṛkṣase.asmākaṃ brahmodyatam |
Translation: 7 O Indra, thou shalt speak us fair: our holy prayer is offered up.

Sanskit Text: तत तवायाचामहे.अवः शुष्णं यद धन्नमानुषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat tvāyācāmahe.avaḥ śuṣṇaṃ yad dhannamānuṣam ||
Translation: We pray to thee for help as thou didst strike the monster Śuṣṇa dead.

Sanskit Text: अकर्मा दस्युरभि नो अमन्तुरन्यव्रतो अमानुषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: akarmā dasyurabhi no amanturanyavrato amānuṣaḥ |
Translation: 8 Around us is the Dasyu, riteless, void of sense, inhuman, keeping alien laws.

Sanskit Text: तवन्तस्यामित्रहन वधर्दासस्य दम्भय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvantasyāmitrahan vadhardāsasya dambhaya ||
Translation: Baffle, thou Slayer of the foe, the weapon which this Dāsa wields.

Sanskit Text: तवं न इन्द्र शूर शूरैरुत तवोतासो बर्हणा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ na indra śūra śūrairuta tvotāso barhaṇā |
Translation: 9 Hero with Heroes, thou art ours: yea, strong are they whom thou dost help.

Sanskit Text: पुरुत्राते वि पूर्तयो नवन्त कषोणयो यथा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purutrāte vi pūrtayo navanta kṣoṇayo yathā ||
Translation: In many a place are thy full gifts, and men, like vassals, sing thy praise.

Sanskit Text: तवं तान वर्त्रहत्ये चोदयो नॄन कार्पाणे शूर वज्रिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tān vṛtrahatye codayo nṝn kārpāṇe śūra vajrivaḥ |
Translation: 10 Urge thou these heroes on to slay the enemy, brave Thunderer! in the fight with swords.

Sanskit Text: गुहा यदी कवीनां विशां नक्षत्रशवसाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghuhā yadī kavīnāṃ viśāṃ nakṣatraśavasām ||
Translation: Even when hid among the tribes of Sages numerous as stars.

Sanskit Text: मक्षू ता त इन्द्र दानाप्नस आक्षाणे शूर वज्रिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: makṣū tā ta indra dānāpnasa ākṣāṇe śūra vajrivaḥ |
Translation: 11 Swift come those gifts of thine whose hand is prompt to rend and burn, O Hero Thunder-armed:

Sanskit Text: यद ध शुष्णस्य दम्भयो जातं विश्वं सयावभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad dha śuṣṇasya dambhayo jātaṃ viśvaṃ sayāvabhiḥ ||
Translation: As thou with thy Companions didst destroy the whole of SuSnia's brood.

Sanskit Text: माकुध्र्यगिन्द्र शूर वस्वीरस्मे भूवन्नभिष्टयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mākudhryaghindra śūra vasvīrasme bhūvannabhiṣṭayaḥ |
Translation: 12 Let not thine excellent assistance come to us, O Hero Indra, profitless.

Sanskit Text: वयं-वयं त आसां सुम्ने सयाम वज्रिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ-vayaṃ ta āsāṃ sumne syāma vajrivaḥ ||
Translation: May we, may we enjoy the bliss of these thy favours, Thunderer!

Sanskit Text: अस्मे ता त इन्द्र सन्तु सत्याहिंसन्तीरुपस्प्र्शः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme tā ta indra santu satyāhiṃsantīrupaspṛśaḥ |
Translation: 13 May those soft impulses of thine, O Indra, be fruitful and innocent to us.

Sanskit Text: विद्यामयासां भुजो धेनूनां न वज्रिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidyāmayāsāṃ bhujo dhenūnāṃ na vajrivaḥ ||
Translation: May we know these whose treasures are like those of milch-kine, Thunderer!

Sanskit Text: अहस्ता यदपदी वर्धत कषाः शचीभिर्वेद्यानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahastā yadapadī vardhata kṣāḥ śacībhirvedyānām |
Translation: 14 That Earth, through power of knowing things that may be known, handless and footless yet might thrive,

Sanskit Text: शुष्णं परि परदक्षिणिद विश्वायवे नि शिश्नथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śuṣṇaṃ pari pradakṣiṇid viśvāyave ni śiśnathaḥ ||
Translation: Thou slewest, turning to the right, gu;na for every living man.

Sanskit Text: पिबा-पिबेदिन्द्र शूर सोमं मा रिषण्यो वसवान वसुःसन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibā-pibedindra śūra somaṃ mā riṣaṇyo vasavāna vasuḥsan |
Translation: 15 Drink, drink the Soma, Hero Indra; be not withheld as thou art good, O Treasure-giver.

Sanskit Text: उत तरायस्व गर्णतो मघोनो महश्च रायो रेवतस्क्र्धी नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta trāyasva ghṛṇato maghono mahaśca rāyo revataskṛdhī naḥ ||
Translation: Preserve the singers and our liberal princes, and make us wealthy with abundant riches.

Sanskit Text: यजामह इन्द्रं वज्रदक्षिणं हरीणां रथ्यंविव्रतानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajāmaha indraṃ vajradakṣiṇaṃ harīṇāṃ rathyaṃvivratānām |
Translation: 1. INDRA, whose right hand wields the bolt, we worship, driver of Bay Steeds seeking sundered courses.

Sanskit Text: पर शमश्रु दोधुवदूर्ध्वथा भूद विसेनाभिर्दयमानो वि राधसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra śmaśru dodhuvadūrdhvathā bhūd visenābhirdayamāno vi rādhasā ||
Translation: Shaking his beard with might he hath arisen, casting his weapons forth and dealing bounties.

Sanskit Text: हरी नवस्य या वने विदे वस्विन्द्रो मघैर्मघवाव्र्त्रहा भुवत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: harī nvasya yā vane vide vasvindro maghairmaghavāvṛtrahā bhuvat |
Translation: 2 The treasure which his Bay Steeds found at sacrifice,—this wealth made opulent Indra slayer of the foe.

Sanskit Text: रभुर्वाज रभुक्षाः पत्यते शवो.अवक्ष्णौमि दासस्य नाम चित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛbhurvāja ṛbhukṣāḥ patyate śavo.avakṣṇaumi dāsasya nāma cit ||
Translation: Ṛbhu, Ṛbhukṣan, Vāja-he is Lord of Might. The Dāsa's very name I utterly destroy.

Sanskit Text: यदा वज्रं हिरण्यमिदथा रथं हरी यमस्यवहतो वि सूरिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā vajraṃ hiraṇyamidathā rathaṃ harī yamasyavahato vi sūribhiḥ |
Translation: 3 When, with the Princes, Maghavari, famed of old, comes nigh the thunderbolt of gold, and the Controller's car

Sanskit Text: आ तिष्ठति मघवा सनश्रुत इन्द्रोवाजस्य दीर्घश्रवसस पतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tiṣṭhati maghavā sanaśruta indrovājasya dīrghaśravasas patiḥ ||
Translation: Which his two Tawny Coursers draw, then Indra is the Sovran Lord of power whose glory spreads afar.

Sanskit Text: सो चिन नु वर्ष्टिर्यूथ्या सवा सचानिन्द्रः शमश्रूणिहरिताभि परुष्णुते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: so cin nu vṛṣṭiryūthyā svā sacānindraḥ śmaśrūṇiharitābhi pruṣṇute |
Translation: 4 With him too is this rain of his that comes like herds: Indra throws drops of moisture on his yellow beard.

Sanskit Text: अव वेति सुक्षयं सुते मधूदिद्धूनोति वातो यथा वनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava veti sukṣayaṃ sute madhūdiddhūnoti vāto yathā vanam ||
Translation: When the sweet juice is shed he seeks the pleasant place, and stirs the worshipper as wind disturbs the wood.

Sanskit Text: यो वाचा विवाचो मर्ध्रवाचः पुरू सहस्राशिवा जघान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vācā vivāco mṛdhravācaḥ purū sahasrāśivā jaghāna |
Translation: 5 We laud and praise his several deeds of valour who, fatherlike, with power hath made us stronger;

Sanskit Text: तत-तदिदस्य पौंस्यं गर्णीमसि पितेव यस्तविषींवाव्र्धे शवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat-tadidasya pauṃsyaṃ ghṛṇīmasi piteva yastaviṣīṃvāvṛdhe śavaḥ ||
Translation: Who with his voice slew many thousand wicked ones who spake in varied manners with contemptuous cries.

Sanskit Text: सतोमं त इन्द्र विमदा अजीजनन्नपूर्व्यं पुरुतमंसुदानवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stomaṃ ta indra vimadā ajījanannapūrvyaṃ purutamaṃsudānave |
Translation: 6 Indra, the Vimadas have formed for thee a laud, copious, unparalleled, for thee Most Bountiful.

Sanskit Text: विद्मा हयस्य भोजनमिनस्य यदा पशुं नगोपाः करामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidmā hyasya bhojanaminasya yadā paśuṃ naghopāḥ karāmahe ||
Translation: We know the good we gain from him the Mighty One when we attract him as a herdsman calls the kine.

Sanskit Text: माकिर्न एना सख्या वि यौशुस्तव चेन्द्र विमदस्य चर्शेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mākirna enā sakhyā vi yauśustava cendra vimadasya caṛśeḥ |
Translation: 7 Ne’er may this bond of friendship be dissevered, the Ṛṣi Vimada's and thine, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: विद्मा हि ते परमतिं देव जामिवदस्मे ते सन्तुसख्या शिवानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidmā hi te pramatiṃ deva jāmivadasme te santusakhyā śivāni ||
Translation: We know thou carest for us as a brother with us, O God, be thine auspicious friendship.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र सोममिमं पिब मधुमन्तं चमू सुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra somamimaṃ piba madhumantaṃ camū sutam |
Translation: 1. O INDRA, drink this Soma, pressed out in the mortar, full of sweets.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे रयिंनि धारय वि वो मदे सहस्रिणं पुरूवसो विवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme rayiṃni dhāraya vi vo made sahasriṇaṃ purūvaso vivakṣase ||
Translation: Send down to us great riches,—at your glad carouse-in thousands, O Most healthy. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: तवां यज्ञेभिरुक्थैरुप हव्येभिरीमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ yajñebhirukthairupa havyebhirīmahe |
Translation: 2 To thee with sacrifices, with oblations, and with lauds we come.

Sanskit Text: शचीपतेशचीनां वि वो मदे शरेष्ठं नो धेहि वार्यं विवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śacīpateśacīnāṃ vi vo made śreṣṭhaṃ no dhehi vāryaṃ vivakṣase ||
Translation: Lord of all strength and power, grant-at your glad carouse-the best choiceworthy treasure. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: यस पतिर्वार्याणामसि रध्रस्य चोदिता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yas patirvāryāṇāmasi radhrasya coditā |
Translation: 3 Thou who art Lord of precious boons, inciter even of the churl.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्तोतॄणामविता वि वो मदे दविषो नः पाह्यंहसोविवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrastotṝṇāmavitā vi vo made dviṣo naḥ pāhyaṃhasovivakṣase ||
Translation: Guardian of singers, Indra,—at your glad carouse-save us from woe and hatred. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: युवं शक्रा मायाविना समीची नीरमन्थतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ śakrā māyāvinā samīcī nīramanthatam |
Translation: 4 Strong, Lords of Magic power, ye Twain churned the united worlds apart,

Sanskit Text: विमदेनयदिळित नसत्य निरमन्थतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vimadenayadiḷita nasatya niramanthatam ||
Translation: When ye, implored by Vimada, Nāsatyas, forced apart the pair.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवा अक्र्पन्त समिच्योर्निष्पतन्त्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devā akṛpanta samicyorniṣpatantyoḥ |
Translation: 5 When the united pair were rent asunder all the Gods complained.

Sanskit Text: नसत्यवब्रुवन्देवः पुनरा वहतदिति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nasatyavabruvandevaḥ punarā vahataditi ||
Translation: The Gods to the Nāsatyas cried, Bring these together once again.

Sanskit Text: मधुमन मे परायणं मधुमत पुनरयनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: madhuman me parāyaṇaṃ madhumat punarayanam |
Translation: 6 Sweet be my going forth, and rich in sweets be my approach to home.

Sanskit Text: त नो देवदेवतय युवं मधुमतस कर्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta no devadevataya yuvaṃ madhumatas kṛtam ||
Translation: So, through your Deity, both Gods, enrich us with all pleasantness.

Sanskit Text: भद्रं नो अपि वातय मनो दक्षमुत करतुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadraṃ no api vātaya mano dakṣamuta kratum |
Translation: 1. SEND us a good and happy mind, send energy and mental power.

Sanskit Text: अधा तेसख्ये अन्धसो वि वो मदे रणन गवो न यवसे विवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā tesakhye andhaso vi vo made raṇan ghavo na yavase vivakṣase ||
Translation: Then-at your glad carouse-let men joy in thy love, Sweet juice! as kine in pasture. Thou. art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: हर्दिस्प्र्शस्त असते विश्वेषु सोम ध मसु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hṛdispṛśasta asate viśveṣu soma dha masu |
Translation: 2 rn all thy forms, O Soma, rest thy powers that influence the heart.

Sanskit Text: अधा कामा इमेमम वि वो मदे वि तिष्ठन्ते वसूयवो विवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā kāmā imemama vi vo made vi tiṣṭhante vasūyavo vivakṣase ||
Translation: So also these my longings-at your glad carouse-spread themselves seeking riches. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: उत वरतनि सोम ते परहं मिनामि पाक्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta vratani soma te prahaṃ mināmi pākyā |
Translation: 3 Even if, O Soma, I neglect thy laws through my simplicity,

Sanskit Text: अधा पितेवसूनवे वि वो मदे मर्ळ नो अभि चिद वधाद विवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā pitevasūnave vi vo made mṛḷa no abhi cid vadhād vivakṣase ||
Translation: Be gracious-at your glad carouse-as sire to son. Preserve us even from slaughter. T'hou. art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: समु पर यन्ति धीतयः सर्गासो.अवतानिव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samu pra yanti dhītayaḥ sarghāso.avatāniva |
Translation: 4 Our songs in concert go to thee as streams of water to the wells.

Sanskit Text: करतुं नःसोम जिवसे वि वो मदे धरया चमसानिव विवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratuṃ naḥsoma jivase vi vo made dharayā camasāniva vivakṣase ||
Translation: Soma, that we may live, grant-at your glad carouse-full powers of mind, like beakers. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: तव तये सोम शक्तिभिर्निकामासो वय रण्विरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava tye soma śaktibhirnikāmāso vy ṛṇvire |
Translation: 5 O Soma, through thy might who art skilful and strong, these longing men,

Sanskit Text: गर्त्सस्यधिरस्तवसो वि वो मदे वरजं गोमन्तमश्विनं विवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtsasyadhirastavaso vi vo made vrajaṃ ghomantamaśvinaṃ vivakṣase ||
Translation: These sages, have thrown open-at your glad carouse-the stall of kine and horses. Thou art waxing great

Sanskit Text: पशुं नः सोम रक्षसि पुरुत्र विष्ठितं जगत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: paśuṃ naḥ soma rakṣasi purutra viṣṭhitaṃ jaghat |
Translation: 6 Our herds thou guardest, Soma, and the moving world spread far and wide.

Sanskit Text: समाक्र्णोषि जीवसे वि वो मदे विश्वा सम्पश्यन भुवनविवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samākṛṇoṣi jīvase vi vo made viśvā sampaśyan bhuvanavivakṣase ||
Translation: Thou fittest them for living,—at your glad carouse-looking upon all beings. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: तवं नः सोम विश्वतो गोप अदभ्यो भव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ soma viśvato ghopa adabhyo bhava |
Translation: 7 On all sides, Soma, be to us a Guardian ne’er to be deceived.

Sanskit Text: सेध राजन्नपस्रिधो वि वो मदे म नो दुः शंस ईशता विवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sedha rājannapasridho vi vo made ma no duḥ śaṃsa īśatā vivakṣase ||
Translation: King, drive away our foemen-at your glad carouse:—let not the wicked rule us. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: तवं नः सोम सुक्रतुर्व योधेयाय जाग्र्हि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ soma sukraturva yodheyāya jāghṛhi |
Translation: 8 Be watchful, Soma, passing wise, to give us store of vital strength.

Sanskit Text: कषेत्रवित्तरोमनुषो वि वो मदे दरुहो नः पाह्यंहसो विवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣetravittaromanuṣo vi vo made druho naḥ pāhyaṃhaso vivakṣase ||
Translation: More skilled than man to guide us,—at your glad carouse-save us from harm and sorrow. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: तवं नो वर्त्र हन्तमेन्द्रस्येन्दो शिवः सखा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ no vṛtra hantamendrasyendo śivaḥ sakhā |
Translation: 9 Chief slayer of our foemen, thou, Indu, art Indra's gracious Friend,

Sanskit Text: यत सिंहवन्ते समिथे वि वो मदे युध्यमनस्तोकसातौविवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat siṃhavante samithe vi vo made yudhyamanastokasātauvivakṣase ||
Translation: When warriors invoke him-at your glad carouse -in fight, to win them offspring. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: अयं घ स तुरो मद इन्द्रस्य वर्धत परियः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ gha sa turo mada indrasya vardhata priyaḥ |
Translation: 10 Victorious is this gladdening drink: to Indra dear it grows in strength.

Sanskit Text: अयंकक्षीवतो महो वि वो मदे मतिं विप्रस्य वर्धयद्विवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃkakṣīvato maho vi vo made matiṃ viprasya vardhayadvivakṣase ||
Translation: This-at your glad carouse -enhanced the mighty hymn of the great sage Kakṣīvān. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: अयं विप्रय दशुषे वजनियर्ति गोमतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ vipraya daśuṣe vajaniyarti ghomataḥ |
Translation: 11 This to the sage who offers gifts brings power that comes from wealth in kine.

Sanskit Text: अयंसप्तभ्य आ वरं वि वो मदे परन्धं शरोणं चतरिषद विवक्षसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃsaptabhya ā varaṃ vi vo made prandhaṃ śroṇaṃ catariṣad vivakṣase ||
Translation: This, better than the seven, hath-at your glad carouse-furthered the blind, the cripple. Thou art waxing great.

Sanskit Text: पर हयछा मनीषा सपार्ह यन्ति नियुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra hyachā manīṣā spārha yanti niyutaḥ |
Translation: 1. FORWARD upon their way proceed the ready teams, the lovely songs.

Sanskit Text: पर दस्रानियुद्रथः पूषा अविष्टु माहिनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra dasrāniyudrathaḥ pūṣā aviṣṭu māhinaḥ ||
Translation: Further them glorious Pūṣan with yoked chariot, and the Mighty Twain!

Sanskit Text: यस्य तयन महित्वं वताप्यमयं जनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya tyan mahitvaṃ vatāpyamayaṃ janaḥ |
Translation: 2 With sacred hymns let this man here, this singer, win the God to whom

Sanskit Text: विप्र आ वंसद्धीतिभिश्चिकेत सुष्टुतीनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vipra ā vaṃsaddhītibhiściketa suṣṭutīnām ||
Translation: Belong this majesty and might. He hath observed our eulogies.

Sanskit Text: स वेद सुष्टुतीनामिन्दुर्न पूष वर्षा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa veda suṣṭutīnāmindurna pūṣa vṛṣā |
Translation: 3 Pūṣan the Strong hath knowledge of sweet praises even as Indu hath.

Sanskit Text: अभि पसुरःप्रुषायति वरजं न आ परुषायति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi psuraḥpruṣāyati vrajaṃ na ā pruṣāyati ||
Translation: He dews our corn with moisture, he bedews the pasture of our kine.

Sanskit Text: मंसीमहि तवा वयमस्माकं देव पूषन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: maṃsīmahi tvā vayamasmākaṃ deva pūṣan |
Translation: 4 We will bethink ourselves of thee, O Pūṣan, O thou God, as One.

Sanskit Text: मत्मां चसाधनं विप्राणां चाधवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: matmāṃ casādhanaṃ viprāṇāṃ cādhavam ||
Translation: Who brings fulfilment of our hymns, and stirs the singer and the sage.

Sanskit Text: परत्यर्धिर्यज्ञनामश्वहयो रथानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratyardhiryajñanāmaśvahayo rathānām |
Translation: 5 joint-sharer of each sacrifice, the driver of the chariot steeds;

Sanskit Text: रषिः स योमनुर्हितो विप्रस्य यावयत्सखः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṣiḥ sa yomanurhito viprasya yāvayatsakhaḥ ||
Translation: The Ṛṣi who is good to man, the singer's Friend and faithful Guard.

Sanskit Text: अधीषमाणायाः पतिः शुचायाश्च शुचस्य च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhīṣamāṇāyāḥ patiḥ śucāyāśca śucasya ca |
Translation: 6 One who is Lord of Suca, Lord of Suca caring for herself:

Sanskit Text: वासोवयो.अवीनामा वासांसि मर्म्र्जत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāsovayo.avīnāmā vāsāṃsi marmṛjat ||
Translation: Weaving the raiment of the sheep and making raiment beautiful.

Sanskit Text: इनो वाजानां पतिरिनः पुष्टीनं सख |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ino vājānāṃ patirinaḥ puṣṭīnaṃ sakha |
Translation: 7 The mighty Lord of spoil and wealth, Strong Friend of all prosperity;

Sanskit Text: पर शमश्रुहर्यतो दूधोद वि वर्थ यो अदाभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra śmaśruharyato dūdhod vi vṛtha yo adābhyaḥ ||
Translation: He with light movement shakes his beard, lovely and ne’er to be deceived.

Sanskit Text: आ ते रथस्य पूषन्नजा धुरं वव्र्त्युः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā te rathasya pūṣannajā dhuraṃ vavṛtyuḥ |
Translation: 8 O Pūṣan, may those goats of thine turn hitherward thy chariot-pole.

Sanskit Text: विश्वस्यार्थिनः सखा सनोजा अनपच्युतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvasyārthinaḥ sakhā sanojā anapacyutaḥ ||
Translation: Friend of all suppliants; art thou, born in old time, and arm and sure.

Sanskit Text: अस्मकमुर्जा रथं पूषा अविष्टु माहिनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmakamurjā rathaṃ pūṣā aviṣṭu māhinaḥ |
Translation: 9 May the majestic Pūṣan speed our chariot with his power and might.

Sanskit Text: भुवद्वजनां वर्ध इमं नः शर्णवद धवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhuvadvajanāṃ vṛdha imaṃ naḥ śṛṇavad dhavam ||
Translation: May he increase our store of wealth and listen to this call of ours.

Sanskit Text: असत सु मे जरितः साभिवेगो यत सुन्वते यजमनय शिक्षम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asat su me jaritaḥ sābhivegho yat sunvate yajamanaya śikṣam |
Translation: 1. THIS, singer, is my firm determination, to aid the worshipper who pours the Soma.

Sanskit Text: अनाशीर्दामहमस्मि परहन्ता सत्यध्व्र्तं वर्जिनायन्तमाभुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anāśīrdāmahamasmi prahantā satyadhvṛtaṃ vṛjināyantamābhum ||
Translation: I slay the man who brings no milkoblation, unrighteous, powerful, the truth's perverter.

Sanskit Text: यदीदहं युधये संनयान्यदेवयून तन्वाशूशुजानान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadīdahaṃ yudhaye saṃnayānyadevayūn tanvāśūśujānān |
Translation: 2 Then Will I, when I lead my friends to battle against the radiant persons of the godless,

Sanskit Text: अमा ते तुम्रं वर्षभं पचानि तीव्रंसुतं पञ्चदशं नि षिञ्चम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: amā te tumraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ pacāni tīvraṃsutaṃ pañcadaśaṃ ni ṣiñcam ||
Translation: Prepare for thee at home a vigorous bullock, and pour for thee the fifteen-fold strong juices.

Sanskit Text: नाहं तं वेद य इति बरवीत्यदेवयून समरणेजघन्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāhaṃ taṃ veda ya iti bravītyadevayūn samaraṇejaghanvān |
Translation: 3 I know not him who sayeth and declareth that he hath slain the godless in the battle.

Sanskit Text: यदावाख्यत समरणं रघावदादिद ध मेव्र्षभा पर बरुवन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadāvākhyat samaraṇaṃ ṛghāvadādid dha mevṛṣabhā pra bruvanti ||
Translation: Soon as they see the furious combat raging, men speak forth praises of my vigorous horses.

Sanskit Text: यदज्ञातेषु वर्जनेष्वासं विश्वे सतो मघवानो मासन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadajñāteṣu vṛjaneṣvāsaṃ viśve sato maghavāno maāsan |
Translation: 4 While yet my deeds of might were unrecorded, all passed for Maghavans though I existed.

Sanskit Text: जिनामि वेत कषेम आ सन्तमाभुं पर तंक्षिणां पर्वते पादग्र्ह्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jināmi vet kṣema ā santamābhuṃ pra taṃkṣiṇāṃ parvate pādaghṛhya ||
Translation: The potent one who dwelt in peace I conquered, grasped by the foot and slew him on the mountain.

Sanskit Text: न वा उ मां वर्जने वारयन्ते न पर्वतासो यदहम्मनस्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na vā u māṃ vṛjane vārayante na parvatāso yadahammanasye |
Translation: 5 None hinder me in mine heroic exploits, no, not the mountains when I will and purpose.

Sanskit Text: मम सवनात कर्धुकर्णो भयात एवेदनु दयून्किरणः समेजात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mama svanāt kṛdhukarṇo bhayāta evedanu dyūnkiraṇaḥ samejāt ||
Translation: Even the deaf will tremble at my roaring, and every day will dust be agitated.

Sanskit Text: दर्शन नवत्र शर्तपाननिन्द्रान बाहुक्षदः शरवेपत्यमानान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: darśan nvatra śṛtapānanindrān bāhukṣadaḥ śaravepatyamānān |
Translation: 6 To see the Indraless oblation-drinkers, mean offerers, o’ertaken by destruction!

Sanskit Text: घर्षुं वा ये निनिदुः सखायमध्यू नवेषु पवयो वव्र्त्युः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛṣuṃ vā ye niniduḥ sakhāyamadhyū nveṣu pavayo vavṛtyuḥ ||
Translation: Then shall the fellies of my car pass over those who have blamed my joyous Friend and scorned him.

Sanskit Text: अभूर्वौक्षीर्व्यु आयुरानड दर्षन नु पूर्वो अपरोनु दर्षत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhūrvaukṣīrvyu āyurānaḍ darṣan nu pūrvo aparonu darṣat |
Translation: 7 Thou wast, thou grewest to full vital vigour: an earlier saw, a later one shall see thee.

Sanskit Text: दवे पवस्ते परि तं न भूतो यो अस्य पारेरजसो विवेष ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dve pavaste pari taṃ na bhūto yo asya pārerajaso viveṣa ||
Translation: Two canopies, as ’twere, are round about him who reacheth to the limit of this region.

Sanskit Text: गावो यवं परयुता अर्यो अक्षन ता अपश्यं सहगोपाश्चरन्तीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāvo yavaṃ prayutā aryo akṣan tā apaśyaṃ sahaghopāścarantīḥ |
Translation: 8 The freed kine eat the barley of the pious. 1 saw them as they wandered with the herdsman.

Sanskit Text: हवा इदर्यो अभितः समायन कियदासुस्वपतिश्छन्दयाते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: havā idaryo abhitaḥ samāyan kiyadāsusvapatiśchandayāte ||
Translation: The calling of the pious rang around them. What portion will these kine afford their owner?

Sanskit Text: सं यद वयं यवसादो जनानामहं यवाद उर्वज्रेन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ yad vayaṃ yavasādo janānāmahaṃ yavāda urvajreantaḥ |
Translation: 9 When we who cat the grass of men are gathered I am with barley-eaters in the corn-land.

Sanskit Text: अत्रा युक्तो.अवसातारमिछादथो अयुक्तं युनजद्ववन्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrā yukto.avasātāramichādatho ayuktaṃ yunajadvavanvān ||
Translation: There shall the captor yoke the yokeless bullock, and he who hath been yoked seek one to loose him.

Sanskit Text: अत्रेदु मे मंससे सत्यमुक्तं दविपाच्च यच्चतुष्पात्संस्र्जानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: atredu me maṃsase satyamuktaṃ dvipācca yaccatuṣpātsaṃsṛjāni |
Translation: 10 There wilt thou hold as true my spoken purpose, to bring together quadrupeds. and bipeds.

Sanskit Text: सत्रीभिर्यो अत्र वर्षणं पर्तन्यादयुद्धोस्य वि भजानि वेदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: strībhiryo atra vṛṣaṇaṃ pṛtanyādayuddhoasya vi bhajāni vedaḥ ||
Translation: I will divide, without a fight, his riches who warreth here, against the Bull, with women.

Sanskit Text: यस्यानक्षा दुहिता जात्वास कस्तां विद्वानभिमन्याते अन्धाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasyānakṣā duhitā jātvāsa kastāṃ vidvānabhimanyāte andhām |
Translation: 11 When a man's daughter hath been ever eyeless, who, knowing, will be wroth with her for blindness?

Sanskit Text: कतरो मेनिं परति तं मुचाते य ईंवहाते य ईं वा वरेयात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kataro meniṃ prati taṃ mucāte ya īṃvahāte ya īṃ vā vareyāt ||
Translation: Which of the two will loose on him his anger-the man who leads her home or he who woos her?

Sanskit Text: कियती योषा मर्यतो वधूयोः परिप्रीता पन्यसावार्येण |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kiyatī yoṣā maryato vadhūyoḥ pariprītā panyasāvāryeṇa |
Translation: 12 How many a maid is pleasing to the suitor who fain would marry for her splendid riches?

Sanskit Text: भद्रा वधूर्भवति यत सुपेशाः सवयं सामित्रं वनुते जने चित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadrā vadhūrbhavati yat supeśāḥ svayaṃ sāmitraṃ vanute jane cit ||
Translation: If the girl be both good and fair of feature, she finds, herself, a friend among the people.

Sanskit Text: पत्तो जगार परत्यञ्चमत्ति शीर्ष्णा शिरः परति दधौवरूथम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: patto jaghāra pratyañcamatti śīrṣṇā śiraḥ prati dadhauvarūtham |
Translation: 13 His feet have grasped: he eats the man who meets him. Around his head he sets the head for shelter.

Sanskit Text: आसीन ऊर्ध्वामुपसि कषिणाति नयंं उत्तानामन्वेति भूमिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsīna ūrdhvāmupasi kṣiṇāti nyaṃṃ uttānāmanveti bhūmim ||
Translation: Sitting anear and right above he smites us, and follows earth that lies spread out beneath him.

Sanskit Text: बर्हन्नछायो अपलाशो अर्वा तस्थौ माता विषितो अत्तिगर्भः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhannachāyo apalāśo arvā tasthau mātā viṣito attigharbhaḥ |
Translation: 14 High, leafless, shadowless, and swift is Heaven: the Mother stands, the Youngling, loosed, is feeding.

Sanskit Text: अन्यस्या वत्सं रिहती मिमाय कया भुवा निदधे धेनुरूधः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anyasyā vatsaṃ rihatī mimāya kayā bhuvā nidadhe dhenurūdhaḥ ||
Translation: Loud hath she lowed, licking Another's offspring. In what world hath the Cow laid down her udder?

Sanskit Text: सप्त वीरासो अधरादुदायन्नष्टोत्तरात्तात समजग्मिरन ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sapta vīrāso adharādudāyannaṣṭottarāttāt samajaghmiran te |
Translation: 15 Seven heroes from the nether part ascended, and from the upper part came eight together.

Sanskit Text: नव पश्चातात सथिविमन्त आयन दश पराक्सानु वि तिरन्त्यश्नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nava paścātāt sthivimanta āyan daśa prāksānu vi tirantyaśnaḥ ||
Translation: Nine from behind came armed with winnowing-baskets: ten from the front pressed o’er the rock's high ridges.

Sanskit Text: दशानामेकं कपिलं समानं तं हिन्वन्ति करतवेपार्याय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśānāmekaṃ kapilaṃ samānaṃ taṃ hinvanti kratavepāryāya |
Translation: 16 One of the ten, the tawny, shared in common, they send to execute their final purpose.

Sanskit Text: गर्भं माता सुधितं वक्षणास्ववेनन्तन्तुषयन्ती बिभर्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: gharbhaṃ mātā sudhitaṃ vakṣaṇāsvavenantantuṣayantī bibharti ||
Translation: The Mother carries on her breast the Infant of noble form and soothes it while it knows not.

Sanskit Text: पीवानं मेषमपचन्त वीरा नयुप्ता अक्षा अनु दीवासन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pīvānaṃ meṣamapacanta vīrā nyuptā akṣā anu dīvaāsan |
Translation: 17 The Heroes dressed with fire the fatted wether: the dice were thrown by way of sport and gaming.

Sanskit Text: दवा धनुं बर्हतीमप्स्वन्तः पवित्रवन्ता चरतःपुनन्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvā dhanuṃ bṛhatīmapsvantaḥ pavitravantā carataḥpunantā ||
Translation: Two reach the plain amid the heavenly waters, hallowing and with means of purifying.

Sanskit Text: वि करोशनासो विष्वञ्च आयन पचाति नेमो नहि पक्षदर्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi krośanāso viṣvañca āyan pacāti nemo nahi pakṣadardhaḥ |
Translation: 18 Crying aloud they ran in all directions: One half of them will cook, and not the other.

Sanskit Text: अयं मे देवः सविता तदाह दर्वन्न इद वनवत्सर्पिरन्नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ me devaḥ savitā tadāha drvanna id vanavatsarpirannaḥ ||
Translation: To me hath Savitar, this God, declared it: He will perform, whose food is wood and butter.

Sanskit Text: अपश्यं गरामं वहमानमारादचक्रया सवधयावर्तमानम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apaśyaṃ ghrāmaṃ vahamānamārādacakrayā svadhayāvartamānam |
Translation: 19 I saw a troop advancing from the distance moved, not by wheels but their own God-like nature.

Sanskit Text: सिषक्त्यर्यः पर युगा जनानां सद्यःशिश्ना परमिनानो नवीयान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: siṣaktyaryaḥ pra yughā janānāṃ sadyaḥśiśnā pramināno navīyān ||
Translation: The Friendly One seeks human generations, destroying, still new bands of evil beings.

Sanskit Text: एतौ मे गावौ परमरस्य युक्तौ मो षु पर सेधीर्मुहुरिन्ममन्धि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etau me ghāvau pramarasya yuktau mo ṣu pra sedhīrmuhurinmamandhi |
Translation: 20 These my two Bulls, even Pramara's, are harnessed: drive them not far; here let them often linger.

Sanskit Text: आपश्चिदस्य वि नशन्त्यर्थं सूरश्च मर्कौपरो बभूवान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpaścidasya vi naśantyarthaṃ sūraśca markauparo babhūvān ||
Translation: The waters even shall aid him to his object, and the all-cleansing Sun who is above us.

Sanskit Text: अयं यो वज्रः पुरुधा विव्र्त्तो.अवः सूर्यस्य बर्हतःपुरीषात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ yo vajraḥ purudhā vivṛtto.avaḥ sūryasya bṛhataḥpurīṣāt |
Translation: 21 This is the thunderbolt which often whirleth down from the lofty misty realm of Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: शरव इदेना परो अन्यदस्ति तदव्यथीजरिमाणस्तरन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrava idenā paro anyadasti tadavyathījarimāṇastaranti ||
Translation: Beyond this realm there is another glory so through old age they pass and feel no sorrow.

Sanskit Text: वर्क्षे-वर्क्षे नियता मीमयद गौस्ततो वयः पर पतान्पुरुषादः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛkṣe-vṛkṣe niyatā mīmayad ghaustato vayaḥ pra patānpuruṣādaḥ |
Translation: 22 Bound fast to,every tree the cow is lowing, and thence the man-consuming birds are flying,

Sanskit Text: अथेदं विश्वं भुवनं भयात इद्रायसुन्वद रषये च शिक्षत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athedaṃ viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃ bhayāta idrāyasunvad ṛṣaye ca śikṣat ||
Translation: Then all this world, though pressing juice for Indra and strengthening the Ṛṣi, is affrighted.

Sanskit Text: देवानां माने परथमा अतिष्ठन कर्न्तत्रदेषमुपर उदायन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānāṃ māne prathamā atiṣṭhan kṛntatradeṣamupara udāyan |
Translation: 23 In the Gods’ mansion stood the first-created, and from their separation came the later.

Sanskit Text: तरयस्तपन्ति पर्थिविमनूप दव बर्बूकं वहतःपुरीषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trayastapanti pṛthivimanūpa dva bṛbūkaṃ vahataḥpurīṣam ||
Translation: Three warm the Earth while holding stores of water, and Two of these convey the murmuring moisture.

Sanskit Text: सा ते जीवातुरुत तस्य विद्धि म समैताद्र्गप गूहःसमर्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā te jīvāturuta tasya viddhi ma smaitādṛghapa ghūhaḥsamarye |
Translation: 24 This is thy life: and do thou mark and know it. As such, hide not thyself in time of battle.

Sanskit Text: अविः सवः कर्णुते गूहते बुसं स पादुरस्यनिर्णिजो न मुच्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aviḥ svaḥ kṛṇute ghūhate busaṃ sa pādurasyanirṇijo na mucyate ||
Translation: He manifests the light and hides the vapour: his foot is never free from robes that veil it.

Sanskit Text: विश्वो हयन्यो अरिराजगाम ममेदह शवशुरो न जगाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvo hyanyo arirājaghāma mamedaha śvaśuro na jaghāma |
Translation: 1. Now all my other friends are here assembled: my Sire-in-law alone hath not come hither.

Sanskit Text: जक्षीयाद धना उत सोमं पपीयात सवाशितः पुनरस्तं जगायात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jakṣīyād dhanā uta somaṃ papīyāt svāśitaḥ punarastaṃ jaghāyāt ||
Translation: So might he eat the grain and drink the Soma, and, satisfied, return unto; his dwelling.

Sanskit Text: स रोरुवद वर्षभस्तिग्मश्र्न्गो वर्ष्मन तस्थाु वरिमन्नाप्र्थिव्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa roruvad vṛṣabhastighmaśṛngho varṣman tasthāu varimannāpṛthivyāḥ |
Translation: 2 Loud belloweth the Bull whose horns are sharpened: upon the height above earth's breadth he standeth.

Sanskit Text: विश्वेष्वेनं वर्जनेषु पामि यो मे कुक्षिसुतसोमः पर्णाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśveṣvenaṃ vṛjaneṣu pāmi yo me kukṣisutasomaḥ pṛṇāti ||
Translation: That man I guard and save in all his troubles who fills my flanks when he hath shed the Soma.

Sanskit Text: अद्रिणा ते मन्दिन इन्द्र तूयान सुन्वन्ति सोमान पिबसि तवमेशाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adriṇā te mandina indra tūyān sunvanti somān pibasi tvameśām |
Translation: 3 Men with the stone press out for thee, O Indra, strong, gladdening Soma, and thereof thou drinkest.

Sanskit Text: पचन्ति ते वर्षभानत्सि तेषां पर्क्षेण यन्मघवन हूयमानः ||
