Sanskrit Transliteration: pacanti te vṛṣabhānatsi teṣāṃ pṛkṣeṇa yanmaghavan hūyamānaḥ ||
Translation: Bulls they dress for thee, and of these thou eatest when, Maghavan, with food thou art invited.

Sanskit Text: इदं सु मे जरितरा चिकिद्धि परतीपं शापं नद्योवहन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ su me jaritarā cikiddhi pratīpaṃ śāpaṃ nadyovahanti |
Translation: 4 Resolve for me, O singer, this my riddle: The rivers send their swelling water backward:

Sanskit Text: लोपाशः सिंहं परत्यञ्चमत्साः करोष्टावराहं निरतक्त कक्षात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: lopāśaḥ siṃhaṃ pratyañcamatsāḥ kroṣṭāvarāhaṃ niratakta kakṣāt ||
Translation: The fox steals up to the approaching lion: the jackal drives the wild-boar from the brushwood.

Sanskit Text: कथ त एतदहमा चिकेतं गर्त्सस्य पाकस्तवसोमनीषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: katha ta etadahamā ciketaṃ ghṛtsasya pākastavasomanīṣām |
Translation: 5 How shall I solve this riddle, I, the simple, declare the thought of thee the Wise and Mighty?

Sanskit Text: तवं नो विद्वान रतुथा वि वोचो यमर्धं तेमघवन कषेम्या धूः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ no vidvān ṛtuthā vi voco yamardhaṃ temaghavan kṣemyā dhūḥ ||
Translation: Tell us, well knowing, as befits the season: Whitherward is thy prosperous car advancing?

Sanskit Text: एवा हि मां तवसं वर्धयन्ति दिवश्चिन मे बर्हतौत्तरा धुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā hi māṃ tavasaṃ vardhayanti divaścin me bṛhatauttarā dhuḥ |
Translation: 6 Thus do they magnify me, me the mighty higher than even high heaven is my car-pole.

Sanskit Text: पुरू सहस्रा नि शिशामि साकमशत्रुंहि म जनिता जजान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purū sahasrā ni śiśāmi sākamaśatruṃhi ma janitā jajāna ||
Translation: I all at once demolish many thousands: my Sire begot me with no foe to match me.

Sanskit Text: एवा हि मां तवसं जज्ञुरुग्रं कर्मन-कर्मन वर्षणमिन्द्र देवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā hi māṃ tavasaṃ jajñurughraṃ karman-karman vṛṣaṇamindra devāḥ |
Translation: 7 Yea, and the Gods have known me also, Indra, as mighty, fierce and strong in every exploit.

Sanskit Text: वधीं वर्त्रं वज्रेण मन्दसनो.अप वरजम्महिना दाशुषे वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vadhīṃ vṛtraṃ vajreṇa mandasano.apa vrajammahinā dāśuṣe vam ||
Translation: Exulting with the bolt I slaughtered Vṛtra, and for the offerer oped with might the cow-stall.

Sanskit Text: देवास आयन परशून्रबिभ्रन वना वर्श्चन्तो अभि विड्भिरायन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāsa āyan paraśūnrabibhran vanā vṛścanto abhi viḍbhirāyan |
Translation: 8 The Deities approached, they carried axes; splitting the wood they came with their attendants.

Sanskit Text: नि सुद्र्वं दधतो वक्षणासु यत्रा कर्पीटमनुतद दहन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni sudrvaṃ dadhato vakṣaṇāsu yatrā kṛpīṭamanutad dahanti ||
Translation: They laid good timber in the fire-receivers, and burnt the grass up where they found it growing.

Sanskit Text: शशः कषुरं परत्यञ्चं जगाराद्रिं लोगेन वयभेदमारात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaśaḥ kṣuraṃ pratyañcaṃ jaghārādriṃ loghena vyabhedamārāt |
Translation: 9 The hare hath swallowed up the opposing razor: I sundered with a clod the distant mountain.

Sanskit Text: बर्हन्तं चिद रहते रन्धयानि वयद वत्सो वर्षभंशूशुवानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhantaṃ cid ṛhate randhayāni vayad vatso vṛṣabhaṃśūśuvānaḥ ||
Translation: The great will I make subject to the little: the calf shall wax in strength and cat the bullock.

Sanskit Text: सुपर्ण इत्था नखमा सिषायावरुद्धः परिपदं नसिंहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suparṇa itthā nakhamā siṣāyāvaruddhaḥ paripadaṃ nasiṃhaḥ |
Translation: 10 There hath the strong-winged eagle left his talon, as a snared lion leaves the trap that caught him.

Sanskit Text: निरुद्धश्चिन महिषस्तर्ष्यावान गोधा तस्मायथं कर्षदेतत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niruddhaścin mahiṣastarṣyāvān ghodhā tasmāayathaṃ karṣadetat ||
Translation: Even the wild steer in his thirst is captured: the leather strap still holds his foot entangled.

Sanskit Text: तेभ्यो गोधा अयथं कर्षदेतद ये बरह्मणः परतिपियन्त्यन्नैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tebhyo ghodhā ayathaṃ karṣadetad ye brahmaṇaḥ pratipiyantyannaiḥ |
Translation: 11 So may the leather strap their foot entangle who fatten on the viands of the Brahman.

Sanskit Text: सिम उक्ष्णो.अवस्र्ष्टानदन्ति सवयं बलानितन्वः शर्णानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sima ukṣṇo.avasṛṣṭānadanti svayaṃ balānitanvaḥ śṛṇānāḥ ||
Translation: They all devour the bulls set free to wander, while they themselves destroy their bodies' vigour.

Sanskit Text: एते शमीभिः सुशमी अभूवन ये हिन्विरे तन्वः सोमौक्थैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete śamībhiḥ suśamī abhūvan ye hinvire tanvaḥ somaukthaiḥ |
Translation: 12 They were well occupied with holy duties who sped in person with their lauds to Soma.

Sanskit Text: नर्वद वदन्नुप नो माहि वाजान दिवि शरवोदधिषे नाम वीरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛvad vadannupa no māhi vājān divi śravodadhiṣe nāma vīraḥ ||
Translation: Speaking like man, mete to us wealth and booty: in heaven thou hast the name and fame of Hero.

Sanskit Text: वने न वा यो नयधायि चाकञ्छुचिर्वां सतोमो भुरणावजीगः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vane na vā yo nyadhāyi cākañchucirvāṃ stomo bhuraṇāvajīghaḥ |
Translation: 1. As sits the young bird on the tree rejoicing, ye, swift Pair, have been roused by clear laudation,

Sanskit Text: यस्येदिन्द्रः पुरुदिनेषु होता नर्णां नर्योन्र्तमः कषपावान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasyedindraḥ purudineṣu hotā nṛṇāṃ naryonṛtamaḥ kṣapāvān ||
Translation: Whose Herald-Priest through many days is Indra, earth's Guardian, Friend of men, the best of Heroes.

Sanskit Text: पर ते अस्या उषसः परापरस्या नर्तौ सयाम नर्तमस्यन्र्णाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te asyā uṣasaḥ prāparasyā nṛtau syāma nṛtamasyanṛṇām |
Translation: 2 May we, when this Dawn and the next dance hither, be thy best servants, most heroic Hero!

Sanskit Text: अनु तरिशोकः शतमावहन नॄन कुत्सेन रथो योसत ससवान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu triśokaḥ śatamāvahan nṝn kutsena ratho yoasat sasavān ||
Translation: Let the victorious car with triple splendour bring hitherward the hundred chiefs with Kutsa.

Sanskit Text: कस्ते मद इन्द्र रन्त्यो भूद दुरो गिरो अभ्युग्रो वि धाव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaste mada indra rantyo bhūd duro ghiro abhyughro vi dhāva |
Translation: 3 What was the gladdening draught that pleased thee, Indra? Speed through our doors to songs, for thou art mighty.

Sanskit Text: कद वाहो अर्वागुप मा मनीषा आ तवा शक्यमुपमंराधो अन्नैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kad vāho arvāghupa mā manīṣā ā tvā śakyamupamaṃrādho annaiḥ ||
Translation: Why comest thou to me, what gift attracts thee? Fain would I bring thee food most meet to offer.

Sanskit Text: कदु दयुम्नमिन्द्र तवावतो नॄन कया धिया करसे कन नागन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadu dyumnamindra tvāvato nṝn kayā dhiyā karase kan naāghan |
Translation: 4 Indra, what fame hath one like thee mid heroes? With what plan wilt thou act? Why hast thou sought us?

Sanskit Text: मित्रो न सत्य उरुगाय भर्त्या अन्ने समस्य यदसन्मनीषाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitro na satya urughāya bhṛtyā anne samasya yadasanmanīṣāḥ ||
Translation: As a true Friend, Wide-Strider! to sustain us, since food absorbs the thought of each among us.

Sanskit Text: परेरय सूरो अर्थं न पारं ये अस्य कामं जनिधा इवग्मन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: preraya sūro arthaṃ na pāraṃ ye asya kāmaṃ janidhā ivaghman |
Translation: 5 Speed happily those, as Sūrya ends his journey, who meet his wish as bridegrooms meet their spouses;

Sanskit Text: गिरश्च ये ते तुविजात पूर्वीर्नर इन्द्रप्रतिशिक्षन्त्यन्नैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghiraśca ye te tuvijāta pūrvīrnara indrapratiśikṣantyannaiḥ ||
Translation: Men who present, O Indra strong by nature, with food the many songs that tell thy praises.

Sanskit Text: मात्रे नु ते सुमिते इन्द्र पूर्वी दयौर्मज्मना पर्थिवीकाव्येन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mātre nu te sumite indra pūrvī dyaurmajmanā pṛthivīkāvyena |
Translation: 6 Thine are two measures, Indra, wide-wellmeted, heaven for thy majesty, earth for thy wisdom.

Sanskit Text: वराय ते घर्तवन्तः सुतासः सवाद्मन भवन्तुपीतये मधूनि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: varāya te ghṛtavantaḥ sutāsaḥ svādman bhavantupītaye madhūni ||
Translation: Here for thy choice are Somas mixed with butter: may the sweet meath be pleasant for thy drinking.

Sanskit Text: आ मध्वो अस्मा असिचन्नमत्रमिन्द्राय पूर्णं स हिसत्यराधाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā madhvo asmā asicannamatramindrāya pūrṇaṃ sa hisatyarādhāḥ |
Translation: 7 They have poured out a bowl to him, to Indra, full of sweet juice, for faithful is his bounty.

Sanskit Text: स वाव्र्धे वरिमन्ना पर्थिव्या अभि करत्वानर्यः पौंस्यैश्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vāvṛdhe varimannā pṛthivyā abhi kratvānaryaḥ pauṃsyaiśca ||
Translation: O'er earth's expanse hath he grown great by wisdom, the Friend of man, and by heroic exploits.

Sanskit Text: वयानळ इन्द्रः पर्तनाः सवोजा आस्मै यतन्ते सख्यायपूर्वीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyānaḷ indraḥ pṛtanāḥ svojā āsmai yatante sakhyāyapūrvīḥ |
Translation: 8 Indra hath conquered in his wars, the Mighty: men strive in multitudes to win his friendship.

Sanskit Text: आ समा रथं न पर्तनासु तिष्ठ यं भद्रयासुमत्या चोदयासे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā smā rathaṃ na pṛtanāsu tiṣṭha yaṃ bhadrayāsumatyā codayāse ||
Translation: Ascend thy chariot as it were in battle, which thou shalt drive to us with gracious favour.

Sanskit Text: पर देवत्रा बराह्मणे गातुरेत्वपो अछा मनसो नप्रयुक्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra devatrā brāhmaṇe ghāturetvapo achā manaso naprayukti |
Translation: 1. As ’twere with swift exertion of the spirit, let the priest speed to the celestial Waters,

Sanskit Text: महीं मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धासिं पर्थुज्रयसेरीरधा सुव्र्क्तिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahīṃ mitrasya varuṇasya dhāsiṃ pṛthujrayaserīradhā suvṛktim ||
Translation: The glorious food of Varuṇa and Mitra. To him who spreadeth far this laud I offer.

Sanskit Text: अध्वर्यवो हविष्मन्तो हि भूताछाप इतोशतीरुशन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhvaryavo haviṣmanto hi bhūtāchāpa itośatīruśantaḥ |
Translation: 2 Adhvaryus, he ye ready with oblations,, and come with longing to the longing Waters,

Sanskit Text: अव याश्चष्टे अरुणः सुपर्णस्तमास्यध्वमूर्मिमद्या सुहस्ताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava yāścaṣṭe aruṇaḥ suparṇastamāsyadhvamūrmimadyā suhastāḥ ||
Translation: Down on which looks the. purple-tinted Eagle. Pour ye that flowing wave this day, deft-handed.

Sanskit Text: अध्वर्यवो.अप इता समुद्रमपां नपातं हविषा यजध्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhvaryavo.apa itā samudramapāṃ napātaṃ haviṣā yajadhvam |
Translation: 3 Go to the reservoir, O ye Adhvaryus worship the Waters’ Child with your oblations.

Sanskit Text: स वो दददूर्मिमद्या सुपूतं तस्मै सोमं मधुमन्तंसुनोत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vo dadadūrmimadyā supūtaṃ tasmai somaṃ madhumantaṃsunota ||
Translation: A consecrated wave he now will give you, so press for him the Soma rich in sweetness.

Sanskit Text: यो अनिध्मो दीदयदप्स्वन्तर्यं विप्रास ईळतेध्वरेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo anidhmo dīdayadapsvantaryaṃ viprāsa īḷateadhvareṣu |
Translation: 4 He who shines bright in floods, unfed with fuel, whom sages worship at their sacrifices:

Sanskit Text: अपां नपान मधुमतीरपो दा याभिरिन्द्रोवाव्र्धे वीर्याय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāṃ napān madhumatīrapo dā yābhirindrovāvṛdhe vīryāya ||
Translation: Give waters rich in sweets, Child of the Waters, even those which gave heroic might to Indra:

Sanskit Text: याभिः सोमो मोदते हर्षते च कल्याणीभिर्युवतिभिर्नमर्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yābhiḥ somo modate harṣate ca kalyāṇībhiryuvatibhirnamaryaḥ |
Translation: 5 Those in which Soma joys and is delighted, as a young man with fair and pleasant damsels.

Sanskit Text: ता अध्वर्यो अपो अछा परेहि यदासिञ्चाोषधीभिः पुनीतात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā adhvaryo apo achā parehi yadāsiñcāoṣadhībhiḥ punītāt ||
Translation: Go thou unto those Waters, O Adhvaryu, and purify with herbs what thou infusest.

Sanskit Text: एवेद यूने युवतयो नमन्त यदीमुशन्नुशतीरेत्यछ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eved yūne yuvatayo namanta yadīmuśannuśatīretyacha |
Translation: 6 So maidens bow before the youthful gallant who comes with love to them who yearn to meet him.

Sanskit Text: सं जानते मनसा सं चिकित्रे.अध्वर्यवो धिषणापश्चदेवीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ jānate manasā saṃ cikitre.adhvaryavo dhiṣaṇāpaścadevīḥ ||
Translation: In heart accordant and in wish one-minded are the Adhvaryus and the heavenly Waters.

Sanskit Text: यो वो वर्ताभ्यो अक्र्णोदु लोकं यो वो मह्या अभिशस्तेरमुञ्चत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vo vṛtābhyo akṛṇodu lokaṃ yo vo mahyā abhiśasteramuñcat |
Translation: 7 He who made room for you when fast imprisoned, who freed you from the mighty imprecation,—

Sanskit Text: तस्मा इन्द्राय मधुमन्तमूर्मिं देवमादनम्प्र हिणोतनापः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmā indrāya madhumantamūrmiṃ devamādanampra hiṇotanāpaḥ ||
Translation: Even to that Indra send the meath-rich current, the wave that gratifies the Gods, O Waters.

Sanskit Text: परास्मै हिनोत मधुमन्तमूर्मिं गर्भो यो वः सिन्धवोमध्व उत्सः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāsmai hinota madhumantamūrmiṃ gharbho yo vaḥ sindhavomadhva utsaḥ |
Translation: 8 Send forth to him the meath-rich wave, O Rivers, which is your offspring and a well of sweetness,

Sanskit Text: घर्तप्र्ष्ठमीड्यमध्वरेष्वापो रेवतीःश्र्णुता हवं मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtapṛṣṭhamīḍyamadhvareṣvāpo revatīḥśṛṇutā havaṃ me ||
Translation: Oil-balmed, to be implored at sacrifices. Ye wealthy Waters, hear mine invocation.

Sanskit Text: तं सिन्धवो मत्सरमिन्द्रपानमूर्मिं पर हेत य उभेियर्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ sindhavo matsaramindrapānamūrmiṃ pra heta ya ubheiyarti |
Translation: 9 Send forth the rapture-giving wave, O Rivers, which Indra drinks, which sets the Twain in motion;

Sanskit Text: मदच्युतमौशानं नभोजां परि तरितन्तुंविचरन्तमुत्सम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: madacyutamauśānaṃ nabhojāṃ pari tritantuṃvicarantamutsam ||
Translation: The well that springeth from the clouds, desirous, that wandereth triple-formed, distilling transport.

Sanskit Text: आवर्व्र्ततीरध नु दविधारा गोषुयुधो न नियवंचरन्तीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvarvṛtatīradha nu dvidhārā ghoṣuyudho na niyavaṃcarantīḥ |
Translation: 10 These winding Streams which with their double current, like cattle-raiders, seek the lower pastures,—

Sanskit Text: रषे जनित्रीर्भुवनस्य पत्नीरपो वन्दस्वसव्र्धः सयोनीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṣe janitrīrbhuvanasya patnīrapo vandasvasavṛdhaḥ sayonīḥ ||
Translation: Waters which dwell together, thrive together, Queens, Mothers of the world, these, Ṛṣi, honour.

Sanskit Text: हिनोता नो अध्वरं देवयज्या हिनोत बरह्म सनयेधनानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hinotā no adhvaraṃ devayajyā hinota brahma sanayedhanānām |
Translation: 11 Send forth our sacrifice with holy worship send forth the hymn and prayer for gain of riches.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य योगे वि शयध्वमूधः शरुष्टीवरीर्भूतनास्मभ्यमापः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya yoghe vi śyadhvamūdhaḥ śruṣṭīvarīrbhūtanāsmabhyamāpaḥ ||
Translation: For need of sacrifice disclose the udder. Give gracious hearing to our call, O Waters.

Sanskit Text: आपो रेवतीः कषयथा हि वस्वः करतुं च भद्रम्बिभ्र्थाम्र्तं च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpo revatīḥ kṣayathā hi vasvaḥ kratuṃ ca bhadrambibhṛthāmṛtaṃ ca |
Translation: 12 For, wealthy Waters, ye control all treasures: ye bring auspicious intellect and Amṛta.

Sanskit Text: रायश्च सथ सवपत्यस्य पत्नीःसरस्वती तद गर्णते वयो धात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyaśca stha svapatyasya patnīḥsarasvatī tad ghṛṇate vayo dhāt ||
Translation: Ye are the Queens of independent riches Sarasvatī give full life to the singer!

Sanskit Text: परति यदापो अद्र्श्रमायतीर्घ्र्तं पयांसि बिभ्रतीर्मधूनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati yadāpo adṛśramāyatīrghṛtaṃ payāṃsi bibhratīrmadhūni |
Translation: 13 When I behold the Waters coming hither, carrying with them milk and mcath and butter,

Sanskit Text: अध्वर्युभिर्मनसा संविदाना इन्द्राय सोमंसुषुतं भरन्तीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhvaryubhirmanasā saṃvidānā indrāya somaṃsuṣutaṃ bharantīḥ ||
Translation: Bearing the well-pressed Soma juice to Indra, they harmonize in spirit with Adhvaryus.

Sanskit Text: एमा अग्मन रेवतीर्जीवधन्या अध्वर्यवः सादयतासखायः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: emā aghman revatīrjīvadhanyā adhvaryavaḥ sādayatāsakhāyaḥ |
Translation: 14 Rich, they are come with wealth for living beings, O friends, Adhvaryus, seat them in their places.

Sanskit Text: नि बर्हिषि धत्तन सोम्यासो.अपां नप्त्रासंविदानास एनाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni barhiṣi dhattana somyāso.apāṃ naptrāsaṃvidānāsa enāḥ ||
Translation: Seat them on holy grass, ye Soma-bringers in harmony with the Offspring of the Waters.

Sanskit Text: आग्मन्नाप उशतीर्बर्हिरेदं नयध्वरे असदन्देवयन्तीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āghmannāpa uśatīrbarhiredaṃ nyadhvare asadandevayantīḥ |
Translation: 15 Now to this grass are come the longing Waters: the Pious Ones are seated at our worship.

Sanskit Text: अध्वर्यवः सुनुतेन्द्राय सोममभूदु वःसुशका देवयज्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhvaryavaḥ sunutendrāya somamabhūdu vaḥsuśakā devayajyā ||
Translation: Adbvaryus, press the Soma juice for Indra so will the service of the Gods be easy.

Sanskit Text: आ नो देवानामुप वेतु शंसो विश्वेभिस्तुरैरवसेयजत्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no devānāmupa vetu śaṃso viśvebhisturairavaseyajatraḥ |
Translation: 1. MAY benediction of the Gods approach us, holy, to aid us with all rapid succours.

Sanskit Text: तेभिर्वयं सुषखायो भवेम तरन्तो विश्वादुरिता सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tebhirvayaṃ suṣakhāyo bhavema taranto viśvāduritā syāma ||
Translation: Therewith may we be happily befriended, and pass triumphant over all our troubles.

Sanskit Text: परि चिन मर्तो दरविणं ममन्याद रतस्य पथा नमसाविवासेत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari cin marto draviṇaṃ mamanyād ṛtasya pathā namasāvivāset |
Translation: 2 A man should think on wealth and strive to win it by adoration on the path of Order,

Sanskit Text: अत सवेन करतुना सं वदेत शरेयांसन्दक्षं मनसा जग्र्भ्यात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ata svena kratunā saṃ vadeta śreyāṃsandakṣaṃ manasā jaghṛbhyāt ||
Translation: Counsel himself with his own mental insight, and grasp still nobler vigour with his spirit.

Sanskit Text: अधायि धीतिरसस्र्ग्रमंशास्तीर्थे न दस्ममुपयन्त्युमाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhāyi dhītirasasṛghramaṃśāstīrthe na dasmamupayantyumāḥ |
Translation: 3 The hymn is formed, poured are the allotted portions: as to a ford friends come unto the Wondrous.

Sanskit Text: अभ्यानश्म सुवितस्य शूषं नवेदसोम्र्तानामभूम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhyānaśma suvitasya śūṣaṃ navedasoamṛtānāmabhūma ||
Translation: We have obtained the power of case and comfort, we haVe become acquainted, with Immortals.

Sanskit Text: नित्यश्चाकन्यात सवपतिर्दामूना यस्मा उ देवः सवितजजान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nityaścākanyāt svapatirdāmūnā yasmā u devaḥ savitajajāna |
Translation: 4 Pleased be the Eternal Lord who loves the household with this man whom God Savitar created.

Sanskit Text: भगो वा गोभिरर्यमेमनज्यात सो अस्मै चरुश्छदयदुत सयात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhagho vā ghobhiraryamemanajyāt so asmai caruśchadayaduta syāt ||
Translation: May Bhaga Aryaman grace him with cattle: may he appear to him, and be, delightful.

Sanskit Text: इयं सा भूया उषसामिव कष यद ध कषुमन्तःशवसा समायन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyaṃ sā bhūyā uṣasāmiva kṣa yad dha kṣumantaḥśavasā samāyan |
Translation: 5 Like the Dawns' dwelling-place be this assembly, where in their might men rich in food have gathered.

Sanskit Text: अस्य सतुतिं जरितुर्भिक्षमाणा आनः शग्मास उप यन्तु वाजाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya stutiṃ jariturbhikṣamāṇā ānaḥ śaghmāsa upa yantu vājāḥ ||
Translation: Striving to share the praises of this singer. To us come strengthening and effectual riches!

Sanskit Text: अस्येदेषा सुमतिः पप्रथानाभवत पूर्व्या भुमनागौः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asyedeṣā sumatiḥ paprathānābhavat pūrvyā bhumanāghauḥ |
Translation: 6 This Bull's most gracious far-extended favour existed first of all in full abundance.

Sanskit Text: अस्य सनीळा असुरस्य योनौ समान आ भरणेबिभ्रमाणाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya sanīḷā asurasya yonau samāna ā bharaṇebibhramāṇāḥ ||
Translation: By his support they are maintained in common who in the Asura's mansion dwell together.

Sanskit Text: किं सविद वनं क उ स वर्क्ष आस यतो दयावाप्र्थिवीनिष्टतक्षुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kiṃ svid vanaṃ ka u sa vṛkṣa āsa yato dyāvāpṛthivīniṣṭatakṣuḥ |
Translation: 7 What was the tree, what wood, in sooth, produced it, from which they fashioned forth the Earth and Heaven?

Sanskit Text: सन्तस्थाने अजरे इतूती अहानि पूर्वीरुषसो जरन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: santasthāne ajare itaūtī ahāni pūrvīruṣaso jaranta ||
Translation: These Twain stand fast and wax not old for ever: these have sung praise to many a day and morning.

Sanskit Text: नैतावदेना परो अन्यदस्त्युक्षा स दयावाप्र्थिवीबिभर्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: naitāvadenā paro anyadastyukṣā sa dyāvāpṛthivībibharti |
Translation: 8 Not only here is this: more is beyond us. He is the Bull, the Heaven's and Earth's supporter.

Sanskit Text: तवदं पवित्रं कर्णुत सवधावान यदींसूर्यं न हरितो वहन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvadaṃ pavitraṃ kṛṇuta svadhāvān yadīṃsūryaṃ na harito vahanti ||
Translation: With power divine he makes his skin a filter, when the Bay Coursers bear him on as Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: सतेगो न कषामत्येति पर्थ्वीं मिहं न वातो वि हवाति भूम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stegho na kṣāmatyeti pṛthvīṃ mihaṃ na vāto vi havāti bhūma |
Translation: 9 He passes o’er the broad earth like a Stega: he penetrates the world as Wind the mist-cloud.

Sanskit Text: मित्रो यत्र वरुणो अज्यमानो.अग्निर्वने न वयस्र्ष्ट शोकम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitro yatra varuṇo ajyamāno.aghnirvane na vyasṛṣṭa śokam ||
Translation: He, balmed with oil, near Varuṇa and Mitra, like Agni in the wood, hath shot forth splendour.

Sanskit Text: सतरीर्यत सूत सद्यो अज्यमाना वयथिरव्यथिः कर्णुतस्वगोपा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: starīryat sūta sadyo ajyamānā vyathiravyathiḥ kṛṇutasvaghopā |
Translation: 10 When suddenly called the cow that erst was barren, she, self-protected, ended all her troubles.

Sanskit Text: पुत्रो यत पुर्वः पित्रोर्जनिष्ट शम्यां गौर्जगार यद ध पर्छान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: putro yat purvaḥ pitrorjaniṣṭa śamyāṃ ghaurjaghāra yad dha pṛchān ||
Translation: Earth, when the first son sprang from sire and mother, cast up the gami, that which men were seeking.

Sanskit Text: उत कण्वं नर्षदः पुत्रमाहुरुत शयावो धनमादत्तवाजि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta kaṇvaṃ nṛṣadaḥ putramāhuruta śyāvo dhanamādattavāji |
Translation: 11 To Nṛṣad's son they gave the name of Kainva, and he the brown-hued courser won the treasure.

Sanskit Text: पर कर्ष्णाय रुशदपिन्वतोधरतमत्र नकिरस्मा अपीपेत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra kṛṣṇāya ruśadapinvatodhartamatra nakirasmā apīpet ||
Translation: For him dark-coloured streamed the shining udder: none made it swell for him. Thus Order willed it.

Sanskit Text: पर सु गमन्ता धियसानस्य सक्षणि वरेभिर्वरानभिषु परसीदतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra su ghmantā dhiyasānasya sakṣaṇi varebhirvarānabhiṣu prasīdataḥ |
Translation: 1. FORTH speed the Pair to bring the meditating God, benevolent with boons sent in return for boons.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकमिन्द्र उभयं जुजोषति यत्सोम्यस्यान्धसो बुबोधति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākamindra ubhayaṃ jujoṣati yatsomyasyāndhaso bubodhati ||
Translation: May Indra graciously accept both gifts from us, when he hath knowledge of the flowing Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: वीन्द्र यासि दिव्यानि रोचना वि पार्थिवानि रजसापुरुष्टुत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vīndra yāsi divyāni rocanā vi pārthivāni rajasāpuruṣṭuta |
Translation: 2 Thou wanderest far, O Indra, through the spheres of light and realms of earth, the region, thou whom many praise!

Sanskit Text: ये तवा वहन्ति मुहुरध्वरानुप ते सुवन्वन्तु वग्यनानराधसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye tvā vahanti muhuradhvarānupa te suvanvantu vaghyanānarādhasaḥ ||
Translation: Let those who often bring their solemn rites conquer the noisy babblers who present no gifts.

Sanskit Text: तदिन मे छन्त्सत वपुषो वपुष्टरं पुत्रो यज्जानम्पित्रोरधीयति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadin me chantsat vapuṣo vapuṣṭaraṃ putro yajjānampitroradhīyati |
Translation: 3 More beautiful than beauty must this seem to me, when the son duly careth for his parents' line.

Sanskit Text: जाया पतिं वहति वग्नुना सुमत पुंसैद भद्रो वहतुः परिष्क्र्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jāyā patiṃ vahati vaghnunā sumat puṃsaid bhadro vahatuḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ ||
Translation: The wife attracts the husband: with a shout of joy the man's auspicious marriage is performed aright.

Sanskit Text: तदित सधस्थमभि चारु दीधय गावो यच्छासन्वहतुं न धेनवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadit sadhasthamabhi cāru dīdhaya ghāvo yacchāsanvahatuṃ na dhenavaḥ |
Translation: 4 This beauteous place of meeting have I looked upon, where, like milch-cows, the kine order the marriage train;

Sanskit Text: माता यन मन्तुर्यूथस्यपूर्व्याभि वाणस्य सप्तधातुरिज्जनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mātā yan manturyūthasyapūrvyābhi vāṇasya saptadhāturijjanaḥ ||
Translation: Where the Herd's Mother counts as first and best of all, and round her are the seven-toned people of the choir.

Sanskit Text: पर वो.अछा रिरिचे देवयुष पदमेको रुद्रेभिर्यातितुर्वणिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vo.achā ririce devayuṣ padameko rudrebhiryātiturvaṇiḥ |
Translation: 5 The Pious One hath reached your place before the rest: One only moves victorious with the Rudras' band.

Sanskit Text: जरा वा येष्वम्र्तेषु दावने परि वूमेभ्यः सिञ्चता मधु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jarā vā yeṣvamṛteṣu dāvane pari vaūmebhyaḥ siñcatā madhu ||
Translation: To these your helpers pour our meath, Immortal Gods, with whom your song of praise hath power to win their gifts.

Sanskit Text: निधीयमानमपगूळमप्सु पर मे देवानां वरतपाुवाच |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nidhīyamānamapaghūḷamapsu pra me devānāṃ vratapāuvāca |
Translation: 6 He who maintains the Laws of God informed me that thou wast lying hidden in the waters.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो विद्वाननु हि तवा चचक्ष तेनाहमग्नेनुशिष्ट आगाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro vidvānanu hi tvā cacakṣa tenāhamaghneanuśiṣṭa āghām ||
Translation: Indra, who knoweth well, beheld and showed thee. By him instructed am I come, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: अक्षेत्रवित कषेत्रविदं हयप्राट स परैतिक्षेत्रविदानुशिष्टः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: akṣetravit kṣetravidaṃ hyaprāṭ sa praitikṣetravidānuśiṣṭaḥ |
Translation: 7 The stranger asks the way of him who knows it: taught by the skilful guide he travels onward.

Sanskit Text: एतद वै भद्रमनुशासनोस्योतस्रुतिं विन्दत्यञ्जसीनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: etad vai bhadramanuśāsanosyotasrutiṃ vindatyañjasīnām ||
Translation: This is, in truth, the blessing of instruction: he finds the path that leads directly forward.

Sanskit Text: अद्येदु पराणीदममन्निमाहापीव्र्तो अधयन मातुरूधः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adyedu prāṇīdamamannimāhāpīvṛto adhayan māturūdhaḥ |
Translation: 8 Even now he breathed: these days hath he remembered. Concealed, he sucked the bosom of his Mother.

Sanskit Text: एमेनमाप जरिमा युवानमहेळन वसुः सुमनाबभूव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: emenamāpa jarimā yuvānamaheḷan vasuḥ sumanābabhūva ||
Translation: Yet in his youth old age hath come upon him: he hath grown gracious, good, and free from anger.

Sanskit Text: एतानि भद्रा कलश करियाम कुरुश्रवण ददतो मघानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etāni bhadrā kalaśa kriyāma kuruśravaṇa dadato maghāni |
Translation: 9 O Kalasa, all these blessings will we bring them, O Kurusravana, who give rich presents.

Sanskit Text: दान इद वो मघवानः सो अस्त्वयं च सोमो हर्दि यम्बिभर्मि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dāna id vo maghavānaḥ so astvayaṃ ca somo hṛdi yambibharmi ||
Translation: May he, O wealthy princes, and this Soma which I am bearing in my heart, reward you.

Sanskit Text: पर मा युयुज्रे परयुजो जनानां वहामि सम पुषणमन्तरेण |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra mā yuyujre prayujo janānāṃ vahāmi sma puṣaṇamantareṇa |
Translation: 1. THE urgings of the people have impelled me, and by,the nearest way I bring you Pūṣan.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवासो अध मामरक्षन दुःशासुरागादिति घोष आसीत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devāso adha māmarakṣan duḥśāsurāghāditi ghoṣa āsīt ||
Translation: The Universal Gods have brought me safely. The cry was heard, Behold, Dubsasu cometh!

Sanskit Text: सं मा तपन्त्यभितः सपत्नीरिव पर्शवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ mā tapantyabhitaḥ sapatnīriva parśavaḥ |
Translation: 2 The ribs that compass me give pain and trouble me like rival wives.

Sanskit Text: नि बाधतेमतिर्नग्नता जसुर्वेर्न वेवीयते मतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni bādhateamatirnaghnatā jasurverna vevīyate matiḥ ||
Translation: Indigence, nakedness, exhaustion press me sore: my mind is fluttering like a bird's.

Sanskit Text: मूषो न शिश्ना वयदन्ति माध्य सतोतारं ते शतक्रतो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mūṣo na śiśnā vyadanti mādhya stotāraṃ te śatakrato |
Translation: 3 As rats eat weavers' threads, cares are consuming me, thy singer, gatakratu, me.

Sanskit Text: सक्र्त सु नो मघवन्निन्द्र मर्ळयाधा पितेव नो भव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakṛt su no maghavannindra mṛḷayādhā piteva no bhava ||
Translation: Have mercy on us once, O Indra, Bounteous Lord: be thou a Father unto us.

Sanskit Text: कुरुश्रवणमाव्र्णि राजानं तरासदस्यवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kuruśravaṇamāvṛṇi rājānaṃ trāsadasyavam |
Translation: 4 I the priests' Ṛṣi chose as prince most liberal Kurusravana,

Sanskit Text: मंहिष्ठंवाघतां रषिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maṃhiṣṭhaṃvāghatāṃ ṛṣiḥ ||
Translation: The son of Trasadasyu's son,

Sanskit Text: यस्य मा हरितो रथे तिस्रो वहन्ति साधुया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya mā harito rathe tisro vahanti sādhuyā |
Translation: 5 Whose three bays harnessed to the car bear me straight onward: I will laud

Sanskit Text: सतवैसहस्रदक्षिणे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: stavaisahasradakṣiṇe ||
Translation: The giver of a thousand meeds,

Sanskit Text: यस्य परस्वादसो गिर उपमश्रवसः पितुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya prasvādaso ghira upamaśravasaḥ pituḥ |
Translation: 6 The sire of Upamasravas, even him whose words were passing sweet,

Sanskit Text: कषेत्रं नरण्वमूचुषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣetraṃ naraṇvamūcuṣe ||
Translation: As a fair field is to its lord.

Sanskit Text: अधि पुत्रोपमश्रवो नपान मित्रातिथेरिहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi putropamaśravo napān mitrātitherihi |
Translation: 7 Mark, Upamasravas, his son, mark, grandson of Mitratithi:

Sanskit Text: पितुष टे अस्मिवन्दिता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pituṣ ṭe asmivanditā ||
Translation: I am thy father's eulogist.

Sanskit Text: यदीशीयाम्र्तानामुत वा मर्त्यानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadīśīyāmṛtānāmuta vā martyānām |
Translation: 8 If I controlled Immortal Gods, yea, even were I Lord of men,

Sanskit Text: जीवेदिन्मघवा मम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jīvedinmaghavā mama ||
Translation: My liberal prince were living still.

Sanskit Text: न देवानामति वरतं शतात्मा चन जीवति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na devānāmati vrataṃ śatātmā cana jīvati |
Translation: 9 None lives, even had he hundred lives, beyond the statute of the Gods

Sanskit Text: तथायुजा वि वाव्र्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tathāyujā vi vāvṛte ||
Translation: So am I parted from my friend.

Sanskit Text: परावेपा मा बर्हतो मादयन्ति परवातेजा इरिणे वर्व्र्तानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāvepā mā bṛhato mādayanti pravātejā iriṇe varvṛtānāḥ |
Translation: 1. SPRUNG from tall trees on windy heights, these rollers transport me as they turn upon the table.

Sanskit Text: सोमस्येव मौजवतस्य भक्षो विभीदको जाग्र्विर्मह्यमछान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somasyeva maujavatasya bhakṣo vibhīdako jāghṛvirmahyamachān ||
Translation: Dearer to me the die that never slumbers than the deep draught of Mujavan's own Soma.

Sanskit Text: न मा मिमेथ न जिहीळ एषा शिवा सखिभ्य उत मह्यमासीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na mā mimetha na jihīḷa eṣā śivā sakhibhya uta mahyamāsīt |
Translation: 2 She never vexed me nor was angry with me, but to my friends and me was ever gracious.

Sanskit Text: अक्षस्याहमेकपरस्य हेतोरनुव्रतामप जायामरोधम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: akṣasyāhamekaparasya hetoranuvratāmapa jāyāmarodham ||
Translation: For the die's sake, whose single point is final, mine own devoted wife I alienated.

Sanskit Text: दवेष्टि शवश्रूरप जाया रुणद्धि न नाथितो विन्दतेमर्डितारम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dveṣṭi śvaśrūrapa jāyā ruṇaddhi na nāthito vindatemarḍitāram |
Translation: 3 My wife holds me aloof, her mother hates me: the wretched man finds none to give him comfort.

Sanskit Text: अश्वस्येव जरतो वस्न्यस्य नाहं विन्दामिकितवस्य भोगम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvasyeva jarato vasnyasya nāhaṃ vindāmikitavasya bhogham ||
Translation: As of a costly horse grown old and feeble, I find not any profit of the gamester.

Sanskit Text: अन्ये जायां परि मर्शन्त्यस्य यस्याग्र्धद वेदने वाज्यक्षः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anye jāyāṃ pari mṛśantyasya yasyāghṛdhad vedane vājyakṣaḥ |
Translation: 4 Others caress the wife of him whose riches the die hath coveted, that rapid courser:

Sanskit Text: पिता मता भरातर एनमाहुर्न जानीमो नयताबद्धमेतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pitā matā bhrātara enamāhurna jānīmo nayatābaddhametam ||
Translation: Of him speak father, mother, brothers saying, We know him not: bind him and take him with you.

Sanskit Text: यदादीध्ये न दविषाण्येभिः परायद्भ्यो.अव हीयेसखिभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadādīdhye na daviṣāṇyebhiḥ parāyadbhyo.ava hīyesakhibhyaḥ |
Translation: 5 When I resolve to play with these no longer, my friends depart from me and leave me lonely.

Sanskit Text: नयुप्ताश्च बभ्रवो वाचमक्रतनेमीदेषां निष्क्र्तं जारिणीव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nyuptāśca babhravo vācamakratanemīdeṣāṃ niṣkṛtaṃ jāriṇīva ||
Translation: When the brown dice, thrown on the board, have rattled, like a fond girl I seek the place of meeting.

Sanskit Text: सभामेति कितवः पर्छमानो जेष्यामीति तन्वाशूशुजानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sabhāmeti kitavaḥ pṛchamāno jeṣyāmīti tanvāśūśujānaḥ |
Translation: 6 The gamester seeks the gambling-house, and wonders, his body all afire, Shall I be lucky?

Sanskit Text: अक्षासो अस्य वि तिरन्ति कामं परतिदीव्नेदधत आ कर्तानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: akṣāso asya vi tiranti kāmaṃ pratidīvnedadhata ā kṛtāni ||
Translation: Still do the dice extend his eager longing, staking his gains against his adversary.

Sanskit Text: अक्षास इदनकुशिनो नितोदिनो निक्र्त्वानस्तपनास्तापयिष्णवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: akṣāsa idankuśino nitodino nikṛtvānastapanāstāpayiṣṇavaḥ |
Translation: 7 Dice, verily, are armed with goads and driving-hooks, deceiving and tormenting, causing grievous woe.

Sanskit Text: कुमारदेष्णा जयतः पुनर्हणो मध्वासम्प्र्क्ताः कितवस्य बर्हणा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kumāradeṣṇā jayataḥ punarhaṇo madhvāsampṛktāḥ kitavasya barhaṇā ||
Translation: They give frail gifts and then destroy the man who wins, thickly anointed with the player's fairest good.

Sanskit Text: तरिपञ्चाशः करीळति वरात एषां देव इव सवितासत्यधर्मा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tripañcāśaḥ krīḷati vrāta eṣāṃ deva iva savitāsatyadharmā |
Translation: 8 Merrily sports their troop, the three-and-fifty, like Savitar the God whose ways are faithful.

Sanskit Text: उग्रस्य चिन मन्यवे ना नमन्ते राजा चिदेभ्योनम इत कर्णोति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughrasya cin manyave nā namante rājā cidebhyonama it kṛṇoti ||
Translation: They bend not even to the mighty's anger: the King himself pays homage and reveres them.

Sanskit Text: नीचा वर्तन्त उपरि सफुरन्त्यहस्तासो हस्तवन्तं सहन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nīcā vartanta upari sphurantyahastāso hastavantaṃ sahante |
Translation: 9 Downward they roll, and then spring quickly upward, and, handless, force the man with hands to serve them.

Sanskit Text: दिव्या अङगारा इरिणे नयुप्ताः शीताः सन्तो हर्दयंनिर्दहन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divyā aṅghārā iriṇe nyuptāḥ śītāḥ santo hṛdayaṃnirdahanti ||
Translation: Cast on the board, like lumps of magic charcoal, though cold themselves they burn the heart to ashes.

Sanskit Text: जाया तप्यते कितवस्य हीना माता पुत्रस्य चरतः कवस्वित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jāyā tapyate kitavasya hīnā mātā putrasya carataḥ kvasvit |
Translation: 10 The gambler's wife is left forlorn and wretched: the mother mourns the son who wanders homeless.

Sanskit Text: रणावा बिभ्यद धनमिछमानो.अन्येषामस्तमुपनक्तमेति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṇāvā bibhyad dhanamichamāno.anyeṣāmastamupanaktameti ||
Translation: In constant fear, in debt, and seeking riches, he goes by night unto the home of others.

Sanskit Text: सत्रियं दर्ष्ट्वाय कितवं ततापान्येषां जायांसुक्र्तं च योनिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: striyaṃ dṛṣṭvāya kitavaṃ tatāpānyeṣāṃ jāyāṃsukṛtaṃ ca yonim |
Translation: 11 Sad is the gambler when he sees a matron, another's wife, and his well-ordered dwelling.

Sanskit Text: पूर्वाह्णे अश्वान युयुजे हि बभ्रून सोग्नेरन्ते वर्षलः पपाद ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrvāhṇe aśvān yuyuje hi babhrūn soaghnerante vṛṣalaḥ papāda ||
Translation: He yokes the brown steeds in the early morning, and when the fire is cold sinks down an outcast.

Sanskit Text: यो वः सेनानीर्महतो गणस्य राजा वरातस्य परथमोबभूव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vaḥ senānīrmahato ghaṇasya rājā vrātasya prathamobabhūva |
Translation: 12 To the great captain of your mighty army, who hath become the host's imperial leader,

Sanskit Text: तस्मै कर्णोमि न धना रुणध्मि दशाहम्प्राचीस्तद रतं वदामि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmai kṛṇomi na dhanā ruṇadhmi daśāhamprācīstad ṛtaṃ vadāmi ||
Translation: To him I show my ten extended fingers: I speak the truth. No wealth am I withholding.

Sanskit Text: अक्षैर्मा दीव्यः कर्षिमित कर्षस्व वित्ते रमस्व बहुमन्यमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: akṣairmā dīvyaḥ kṛṣimit kṛṣasva vitte ramasva bahumanyamānaḥ |
Translation: 13 Play not with dice: no, cultivate thy corn-land. Enjoy the gain, and deem that wealth sufficient.

Sanskit Text: तत्र गावः कितव तत्र जाया तन मे विचष्टे सवितायमर्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tatra ghāvaḥ kitava tatra jāyā tan me vicaṣṭe savitāyamaryaḥ ||
Translation: There are thy cattle there thy wife, O gambler. So this good Savitar himself hath told me.

Sanskit Text: मित्रं कर्णुध्वं खलु मर्लता नो मा नो घोरेण चरताभिध्र्ष्णु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitraṃ kṛṇudhvaṃ khalu mṛlatā no mā no ghoreṇa caratābhidhṛṣṇu |
Translation: 14 Make me your friend: show us some little mercy. Assail us not with your terrific fierceness.

Sanskit Text: नि वो नु मन्युर्विशतामरातिरन्यो बभ्रूणाम्प्रसितौ नवस्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni vo nu manyurviśatāmarātiranyo babhrūṇāmprasitau nvastu ||
Translation: Appeased be your malignity and anger, and let the brown dice snare some other captive.

Sanskit Text: अबुध्रमु तय इन्द्रवन्तो अग्नयो जयोतिर्भरन्त उषसोव्युष्टिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abudhramu tya indravanto aghnayo jyotirbharanta uṣasovyuṣṭiṣu |
Translation: 1. THESE fires associate with Indra are awake, bringing their light when first the Dawn begins to shine.

Sanskit Text: मही दयावाप्र्थिवी चेततामपो.अद्यादेवानामव आ वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahī dyāvāpṛthivī cetatāmapo.adyādevānāmava ā vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: May Heaven and Earth, great Pair, observe our holy work. We claim for us this day the favour of the Gods.

Sanskit Text: दिवस्प्र्थिव्योरव आ वर्णीमहे मातॄन सिन्धून पर्वताञ्छर्यणावतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divaspṛthivyorava ā vṛṇīmahe mātṝn sindhūn parvatāñcharyaṇāvataḥ |
Translation: 2 Yea, for ourselves we claim the grace of Heaven and Earth, of Śaryaṇāvān, of the Hills and Mother Streams.

Sanskit Text: अनागास्त्वं सूर्यमुषासमीमहे भद्रंसोमः सुवानो अद्या कर्णोतु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anāghāstvaṃ sūryamuṣāsamīmahe bhadraṃsomaḥ suvāno adyā kṛṇotu naḥ ||
Translation: For innocence we pray to Sūrya and to Dawn. So may the flowing Soma bring us bliss to-day.

Sanskit Text: दयावा नो अद्य पर्थिवी अनागसो मही तरायेतां सुवितायमातरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyāvā no adya pṛthivī anāghaso mahī trāyetāṃ suvitāyamātarā |
Translation: 3 May the great Twain, the Mothers, Heaven and Earth, this day preserve us free from sin for peace and happiness.

Sanskit Text: उषा उछन्त्यप बाधतामघं सवस्त्यग्निंसमिधानमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣā uchantyapa bādhatāmaghaṃ svastyaghniṃsamidhānamīmahe ||
Translation: May Morning sending forth her light drive sin afar. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

Sanskit Text: इयं न उस्रा परथमा सुदेव्यं रेवत सनिभ्यो रेवती वयुछतु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyaṃ na usrā prathamā sudevyaṃ revat sanibhyo revatī vyuchatu |
Translation: 4 May this first Dawn bring us the host of gracious Gods: rich, may it richly shine for us who strive for wealth.

Sanskit Text: आरे मन्युं दुर्विदत्रस्य धीमहि सवस्त्यग्निंसमिधानमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āre manyuṃ durvidatrasya dhīmahi svastyaghniṃsamidhānamīmahe ||
Translation: The wrath of the malignant may we keep afar. We pray to kindled Agni for feilicity.

Sanskit Text: पर याः सिस्रते सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिर्ज्योतिर्भरन्तीरुषसो वयुष्टिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yāḥ sisrate sūryasya raśmibhirjyotirbharantīruṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu |
Translation: 5 Dawns, who come forward with the bright beams of the Sun, and at your earliest flushing bring to us the light,

Sanskit Text: भद्रा नो अद्य शरवसे वयुछत सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadrā no adya śravase vyuchata svastyaghniṃ samidhānamīmahe ||
Translation: Shine ye on us to-day auspicious, for renown. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

Sanskit Text: अनमीवा उषस आ चरन्तु न उदग्नयो जिहतां जयोतिषाब्र्हत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anamīvā uṣasa ā carantu na udaghnayo jihatāṃ jyotiṣābṛhat |
Translation: 6 Free from all sickness may the Mornings come to us, and let our fires mount upward with a lofty blaze.

Sanskit Text: आयुक्षातामश्विना तूतुजिं रथं सवस्त्यग्निंसमिधानमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āyukṣātāmaśvinā tūtujiṃ rathaṃ svastyaghniṃsamidhānamīmahe ||
Translation: The Aśvin Pair have harnessed their swift-moving car. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

Sanskit Text: शरेष्ठं नो अद्य सवितर्वरेण्यं भागमा सुव स हिरत्नधा असि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śreṣṭhaṃ no adya savitarvareṇyaṃ bhāghamā suva sa hiratnadhā asi |
Translation: 7 Send us to-day a portion choice and excellent, O Savitar, for thou art he who dealeth wealth.

Sanskit Text: रायो जनित्रीं धिषणामुप बरुवे सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyo janitrīṃ dhiṣaṇāmupa bruve svastyaghniṃ samidhānamīmahe ||
Translation: I cry to Dhiṣaṇā, Mother of opulence. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

Sanskit Text: पिपर्तु मा तद रतस्य परवाचनं देवानां यन मनुष्यामन्महि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pipartu mā tad ṛtasya pravācanaṃ devānāṃ yan manuṣyāamanmahi |
Translation: 8 Further me this declaring of Eternal Law, the Law of Gods, as we mortals acknowledge it!

Sanskit Text: विश्वा इदुस्रा सपळ उदेति सूर्यः सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā idusrā spaḷ udeti sūryaḥ svastyaghniṃ samidhānamīmahe ||
Translation: The Sun goes up beholding all the rays of morn. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

Sanskit Text: अद्वेषो अद्य बर्हिष सतरीमणि गराव्णां योगे मन्मनःसाध ईमहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adveṣo adya barhiṣa starīmaṇi ghrāvṇāṃ yoghe manmanaḥsādha īmahe |
Translation: 9 This day we pray with innocence in strewing grass, adjusting pressing-stones, and perfecting the hymn.

Sanskit Text: आदित्यानां शर्मणि सथा भुरण्यसि सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityānāṃ śarmaṇi sthā bhuraṇyasi svastyaghniṃ samidhānamīmahe ||
Translation: Thou in the Ādityas’ keeping movest restlessly. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

Sanskit Text: आ नो बर्हिः सधमादे बर्हद दिवि देवानीळे सादयासप्त होतॄन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no barhiḥ sadhamāde bṛhad divi devānīḷe sādayāsapta hotṝn |
Translation: 10 To our great holy grass I bid the Gods at morn to banquet, and will seat them as the seven priests,—

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं मित्रं वरुणं सातये भगं सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ mitraṃ varuṇaṃ sātaye bhaghaṃ svastyaghniṃ samidhānamīmahe ||
Translation: Varuṇa, Indra, Mitra, Bhaga for our gain. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

Sanskit Text: त आदित्या आ गता सर्वतातये वर्धे नो यज्ञमवतासजोषसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta ādityā ā ghatā sarvatātaye vṛdhe no yajñamavatāsajoṣasaḥ |
Translation: 11 Come hither, O Ādityas, for our perfect weal: accordant help our sacrifice that we may thrive.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिं पूषणमश्विना भगं सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiṃ pūṣaṇamaśvinā bhaghaṃ svastyaghniṃ samidhānamīmahe ||
Translation: Pūṣan, Bṛhaspati, Bhaga, both Aśvins, and enkindled Agni we implore for happiness.

Sanskit Text: तन नो देवा यछत सुप्रवाचनं छर्दिरादित्याः सुभरंन्र्पाय्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tan no devā yachata supravācanaṃ chardirādityāḥ subharaṃnṛpāyyam |
Translation: 12 Ādityas, Gods, vouchsafe that this our home may be praise-worthy, prosperous, our heroes' sure defence,

Sanskit Text: पश्वे तोकाय तनयाय जीवसे सवस्त्यग्निंसमिधानमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: paśve tokāya tanayāya jīvase svastyaghniṃsamidhānamīmahe ||
Translation: For cattle, for our sons, for progeny, for life. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे अद्य मरुतो विश्व ऊती विश्वे भवन्त्वग्नयःसमिद्धाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve adya maruto viśva ūtī viśve bhavantvaghnayaḥsamiddhāḥ |
Translation: 13 This day may all the Maruts, all he near us with aid: may all our fires be well enkindled.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे नो देवा अवसा गमन्तु विश्वमस्तुद्रविणं वाजो अस्मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve no devā avasā ghamantu viśvamastudraviṇaṃ vājo asme ||
Translation: May all Gods come to us with gracious favour. May spoil and wealth he ours, and all possessions.

Sanskit Text: यं देवासो.अवथ वाजसातौ यं तरायध्वे यं पिप्र्थात्यंहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ devāso.avatha vājasātau yaṃ trāyadhve yaṃ pipṛthātyaṃhaḥ |
Translation: 14 He whom ye aid, O Deities, in battle, whom ye protect and rescue from affliction,

Sanskit Text: यो वो गोपीथे न भयस्य वेद ते सयामदेववीतये तुरासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vo ghopīthe na bhayasya veda te syāmadevavītaye turāsaḥ ||
Translation: Who fears no danger at your milk-libation, -such may we be to feast the Gods, ye Mighty.

Sanskit Text: उषासानक्ता बर्हती सुपेशसा दयावाक्षामा वरुणोमित्रो अर्यमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣāsānaktā bṛhatī supeśasā dyāvākṣāmā varuṇomitro aryamā |
Translation: 1. THERE are the Dawn and Night, the grand and beauteous Pair, Earth, Heaven, and Varuṇa, Mitra, and Aryaman.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं हुवे मरुतः पर्वतानप आदित्यान्द्यावाप्र्थिवी अपः सवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ huve marutaḥ parvatānapa ādityāndyāvāpṛthivī apaḥ svaḥ ||
Translation: Indra I call, the Maruts, Mountains, and the Floods, Ādityas, Heaven and Earth, the Waters, and the Sky.

Sanskit Text: दयौश्च नः पर्थिवी च परचेतस रतावरी रक्षतामंहसोरिषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyauśca naḥ pṛthivī ca pracetasa ṛtāvarī rakṣatāmaṃhasoriṣaḥ |
Translation: 2 May Dyaus and Prthivi, wise, true to Holy Law, keep us in safety from distress and injury.

Sanskit Text: मा दुर्विदत्रा निरतिर्न ईशत तद देवानामवोद्या वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā durvidatrā nirtirna īśata tad devānāmavoadyā vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: Let not malignant Nirrti rule over us. We crave to-day this gracious favour of the Gods.

Sanskit Text: विश्वस्मान नो अदितिः पात्वंहसो माता मित्रस्य वरुणस्यरेवतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvasmān no aditiḥ pātvaṃhaso mātā mitrasya varuṇasyarevataḥ |
Translation: 3 Mother of Mitra and of opulent Varuṇa, may Aditi preserve us safe from all distress.

Sanskit Text: सवर्वज्ज्योतिरव्र्कं नशीमहि तद देवानां ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svarvajjyotiravṛkaṃ naśīmahi tad devānāṃ ... ||
Translation: May we obtain the light of heaven without a foe. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

Sanskit Text: गरावा वदन्नप रक्षांसि सेधतु दुष्वप्न्यं निरतिंविश्वमत्रिणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghrāvā vadannapa rakṣāṃsi sedhatu duṣvapnyaṃ nirtiṃviśvamatriṇam |
Translation: 4 May ringing press-stones keep the Rākṣasas afar, ill dream, and Nirrti, and each voracious fiend.

Sanskit Text: आदित्यं शर्म मरुतामशीमहि तद्देवानां ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityaṃ śarma marutāmaśīmahi taddevānāṃ ... ||
Translation: May the Ādityas and the Maruts shelter us. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

Sanskit Text: एन्द्रो बर्हिः सीदतु पिन्वतामिळा बर्हस्पतिः सामभिरकवो अर्चतु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: endro barhiḥ sīdatu pinvatāmiḷā bṛhaspatiḥ sāmabhirkvo arcatu |
Translation: 5 Full flow libations; on our grass let Indra sit; Bṛhaspati the singer laud with Sāma hymns!

Sanskit Text: सुप्रकेतं जीवसे मन्म धीमहि तद्देवानां ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: supraketaṃ jīvase manma dhīmahi taddevānāṃ ... ||
Translation: Wise be our hearts' imaginings that we may live. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

Sanskit Text: दिविस्प्र्शं यज्ञमस्माकमश्विना जीराध्वरं कर्णुतंसुम्नमिष्टये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divispṛśaṃ yajñamasmākamaśvinā jīrādhvaraṃ kṛṇutaṃsumnamiṣṭaye |
Translation: 6 Ye Aśvins, make our sacrifice ascend to heaven, and animate the rite that it may send us bliss,

Sanskit Text: पराचीनरश्मिमाहुतं घर्तेन तद्देवानां ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prācīnaraśmimāhutaṃ ghṛtena taddevānāṃ ... ||
Translation: Offered with holy oil, with forward-speeding rein. We crave the gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

Sanskit Text: उप हवये सुहवं मारुतं गणं पावकं रष्वं सख्यायशम्भुवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa hvaye suhavaṃ mārutaṃ ghaṇaṃ pāvakaṃ ṛṣvaṃ sakhyāyaśambhuvam |
Translation: 7 Hither I call the band of Maruts, swift to hear, great, purifying, bringing bliss, to he our Friends.

Sanskit Text: रायस पोषं सौश्रवसाय धीमहि तद्देवानां ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyas poṣaṃ sauśravasāya dhīmahi taddevānāṃ ... ||
Translation: May we increase our wealth to glorify our name. We crave this graciousfavour of the Gods to-day.

Sanskit Text: अपां पेरुं जीवधन्यं भरामहे देवाव्यं सुहवमध्वरश्रियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāṃ peruṃ jīvadhanyaṃ bharāmahe devāvyaṃ suhavamadhvaraśriyam |
Translation: 8 We bring the Stay of Life, who makes the waters swell, swift-hearing, Friend of Gods, who waits on sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: सुरश्मिं सोममिन्द्रियं यमीमहि तद्देवानां ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suraśmiṃ somamindriyaṃ yamīmahi taddevānāṃ ... ||
Translation: May we control that Power, Soma whose rays are bright. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

Sanskit Text: सनेम तत सुसनिता सनित्वभिर्वयं जीवा जीवपुत्रानागसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanema tat susanitā sanitvabhirvayaṃ jīvā jīvaputrāanāghasaḥ |
Translation: 9 Alive ourselves, with living sons, devoid of guilt, may we win this with winners by fair means to win.

Sanskit Text: बरह्मद्विषो विष्वगेनो भरेरत तद्देवानां ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmadviṣo viṣvagheno bharerata taddevānāṃ ... ||
Translation: Let the prayer-haters bear our sin to every side. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

Sanskit Text: ये सथा मनोर्यज्ञियास्ते शर्णोतन यद वो देवा ईमहेतद ददातन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye sthā manoryajñiyāste śṛṇotana yad vo devā īmahetad dadātana |
Translation: 10 Hear us, O ye who claim the worship of mankind, and give us, O ye Gods, the gift for which we pray,

Sanskit Text: जैत्रं करतुं रयिमद वीरवद यशस्तद्देवानां ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jaitraṃ kratuṃ rayimad vīravad yaśastaddevānāṃ ... ||
Translation: Victorious wisdom, fame with heroes and with wealth. We crave to-day this gracious favour of the Gods.

Sanskit Text: महदद्य महतामा वर्णीमहे.अवो देवानां बर्हतामनर्वणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahadadya mahatāmā vṛṇīmahe.avo devānāṃ bṛhatāmanarvaṇām |
Translation: 11 We crave the gracious favour of the Gods to-day, great favour of great Gods, sublime and free from foes,

Sanskit Text: यथा वसु वीरजातं नशामहै तद्देवानां ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā vasu vīrajātaṃ naśāmahai taddevānāṃ ... ||
Translation: That we may gain rich treasure sprung from hero sons. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

Sanskit Text: महो अग्नेः समिधानस्य शर्मण्यनागा मित्रे वरुणेस्वस्तये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: maho aghneḥ samidhānasya śarmaṇyanāghā mitre varuṇesvastaye |
Translation: 12 In great enkindled Agni's keeping, and, for bliss, free from all sin before Mitra and Varuṇa.

Sanskit Text: शरेष्ठे सयाम सवितुः सवीमनि तद्देवानां ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śreṣṭhe syāma savituḥ savīmani taddevānāṃ ... ||
Translation: May we share Savitar's best animating help. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

Sanskit Text: ये सवितुः सत्यसवस्य विश्वे मित्रस्य वरते वरुणस्यदेवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye savituḥ satyasavasya viśve mitrasya vrate varuṇasyadevāḥ |
Translation: 13 All ye, the Gods whom Savitar the Father of truth, and Varuṇa and Mitra govern,

Sanskit Text: ते सौभगं वीरवद गोमदप्नो दधातनद्रविणं चित्रमस्मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te saubhaghaṃ vīravad ghomadapno dadhātanadraviṇaṃ citramasme ||
Translation: Give us prosperity with hero children, and opulence in kine and various treasure.

Sanskit Text: सविता पश्चातात सविता पुरस्तात सवितोत्तरात्तात्सविताधरात्तात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: savitā paścātāt savitā purastāt savitottarāttātsavitādharāttāt |
Translation: 14 Savitar, Savitar from cast and westward, Savitar, Savitar from north and southward,

Sanskit Text: सविता नः सुवतु सर्वतातिं सविता नोरासतां दीर्घमयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: savitā naḥ suvatu sarvatātiṃ savitā norāsatāṃ dīrghamayuḥ ||
Translation: Savitar send us perfect health and comfort, Savitar let our days of life be lengthened!

Sanskit Text: नमो मित्रस्य वरुणस्य चक्षसे महो देवाय तद रतंसपर्यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: namo mitrasya varuṇasya cakṣase maho devāya tad ṛtaṃsaparyata |
Translation: 1. Do homage unto Varuṇa's and Mitra's Eye: offer this solemn worship to the Mighty God,

Sanskit Text: दूरेद्र्शे देवजाताय केतवे दिवस पुत्रायसूर्याय शंसत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūredṛśe devajātāya ketave divas putrāyasūryāya śaṃsata ||
Translation: Who seeth far away, the Ensign, born of Gods. Sing praises unto Sūrya, to the Son of Dyaus.

Sanskit Text: सा मा सत्योक्तिः परि पातु विश्वतो दयावा च यत्रततनन्नहानि च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā mā satyoktiḥ pari pātu viśvato dyāvā ca yatratatanannahāni ca |
Translation: 2 May this my truthful speech guard me on every side wherever heaven and earth and days are spread abroad.

Sanskit Text: विश्वमन्यन नि विशते यदेजतिविश्वाहापो विश्वाहोदेति सूर्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvamanyan ni viśate yadejativiśvāhāpo viśvāhodeti sūryaḥ ||
Translation: All else that is in motion finds a place of rest: the waters ever flow and ever mounts the Sun.

Sanskit Text: न ते अदेवः परदिवो नि वासते यदेतशेभिः पतरैरथर्यसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na te adevaḥ pradivo ni vāsate yadetaśebhiḥ patarairatharyasi |
Translation: 3 No godless man from time remotest draws thee down when thou art driving forth with winged dappled Steeds.

Sanskit Text: पराचीनमन्यदनु वर्तते रज उदन्येनज्योतिषा यासि सूर्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prācīnamanyadanu vartate raja udanyenajyotiṣā yāsi sūrya ||
Translation: One lustre waits upon thee moving to the cast, and, Sūrya, thou arisest with a different light.

Sanskit Text: येन सूर्य जयोतिषा बाधसे तमो जगच्च विश्वमुदियर्षिभानुना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena sūrya jyotiṣā bādhase tamo jaghacca viśvamudiyarṣibhānunā |
Translation: 4 O Sūrya, with the light whereby thou scatterest gloom, and with thy ray impellest every moving thing,

Sanskit Text: तेनास्मद विश्वामनिरामनाहुतिमपामीवामप दुष्वप्न्यं सुव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tenāsmad viśvāmanirāmanāhutimapāmīvāmapa duṣvapnyaṃ suva ||
Translation: Keep far from us all feeble, worthless sacrifice, and drive away disease and every evil dream.

Sanskit Text: विश्वस्य हि परेषितो रक्षसि वरतमहेळयन्नुच्चरसिस्वधा अनु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvasya hi preṣito rakṣasi vratamaheḷayannuccarasisvadhā anu |
Translation: 5 Sent forth thou guardest well the Universe's law, and in thy wonted way arisest free from wrath.

Sanskit Text: यदद्य तवा सूर्योपब्रवामहै तं नो देवानु मंसीरत करतुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadadya tvā sūryopabravāmahai taṃ no devāanu maṃsīrata kratum ||
Translation: When Sūrya, we address our prayers to thee to-day, may the Gods favour this our purpose and desire.

Sanskit Text: तं नो दयावाप्र्थिवी तन न आप इन्द्रः शर्ण्वन्तु मरुतोहवं वचः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ no dyāvāpṛthivī tan na āpa indraḥ śṛṇvantu marutohavaṃ vacaḥ |
Translation: 6 This invocation, these our words may Heaven and Earth, and Indra and the Waters and the Maruts hear.

Sanskit Text: मा शूने भूम सूर्यस्य सन्द्र्शिभद्रं जीवन्तो जरणामशीमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā śūne bhūma sūryasya sandṛśibhadraṃ jīvanto jaraṇāmaśīmahi ||
Translation: Ne’er may we suffer want in presence of the Sun, and, living happy lives, may we attain old age.

Sanskit Text: विश्वाहा तवा सुमनसः सुचक्षसः परजावन्तो अनमीवानागसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāhā tvā sumanasaḥ sucakṣasaḥ prajāvanto anamīvāanāghasaḥ |
Translation: 7 Cheerful in spirit, evermore, and keen of sight, with store of children, free from sickness and from sin,

Sanskit Text: उद्यन्तं तवा मित्रमहो दिवे-दिवे जयोग जीवाःप्रति पश्येम सूर्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: udyantaṃ tvā mitramaho dive-dive jyogh jīvāḥprati paśyema sūrya ||
Translation: Long-living, may we look, O Sūrya, upon thee uprising day by day, thou great as Mitra is!

Sanskit Text: महि जयोतिर्बिभ्रतं तवा विचक्षण भास्वन्तं चक्षुषे चक्षुषे मयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahi jyotirbibhrataṃ tvā vicakṣaṇa bhāsvantaṃ cakṣuṣe cakṣuṣe mayaḥ |
Translation: 8 Sūrya, may we live long and look upon thee still, thee, O Far-seeing One, bringing the glorious light,

Sanskit Text: आरोहन्तं बर्हतः पाजसस परि वयंजीवाः परति पश्येम सूर्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ārohantaṃ bṛhataḥ pājasas pari vayaṃjīvāḥ prati paśyema sūrya ||
Translation: The radiant God, the spring of joy to every eye, as thou art mounting up o’er the high shining flood.

Sanskit Text: यस्य ते विश्वा भुवनानि केतुना पर चेरते नि च विशन्तेक्तुभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya te viśvā bhuvanāni ketunā pra cerate ni ca viśanteaktubhiḥ |
Translation: 9 Thou by whose lustre all the world of life comes forth, and by thy beams again returns unto its rest,

Sanskit Text: अनागास्त्वेन हरिकेश सूर्याह्नाह्ना नोवस्यसा-वस्यसोदिहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anāghāstvena harikeśa sūryāhnāhnā novasyasā-vasyasodihi ||
Translation: O Sūrya with the golden hair, ascend for us day after day, still bringing purer innocence.

Sanskit Text: शं नो भव चक्षसा शं नो अह्ना शं भानुना शंहिमा शं घर्णेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no bhava cakṣasā śaṃ no ahnā śaṃ bhānunā śaṃhimā śaṃ ghṛṇena |
Translation: 10 Bless us with shine, bless us with perfect daylight, bless us with cold, with fervent heat and lustre.

Sanskit Text: यथा शमध्वञ्छमसद दुरोणेतत सूर्य दरविणं धेहि चित्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā śamadhvañchamasad duroṇetat sūrya draviṇaṃ dhehi citram ||
Translation: Bestow on us, O Sūrya, varied riches, to bless us in our home and when we travel.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकं देवा उभयाय जन्मने शर्म यछत दविपदेचतुष्पदे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākaṃ devā ubhayāya janmane śarma yachata dvipadecatuṣpade |
Translation: 11 Gods, to our living creatures of both kinds vouchsafe protection, both to bipeds and to quadrupeds,

Sanskit Text: अदत पिबदूर्जयमानमाशितं तदस्मेशं योररपो दधातन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adat pibadūrjayamānamāśitaṃ tadasmeśaṃ yorarapo dadhātana ||
Translation: That they may drink and eat invigorating food. So grant us health and strength and perfect innocence.

Sanskit Text: यद वो देवाश्चक्र्म जिह्वया गुरु मनसो वा परयुतीदेवहेळनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vo devāścakṛma jihvayā ghuru manaso vā prayutīdevaheḷanam |
Translation: 12 If by some grievous sin we have provoked the Gods, O Deities, with the tongue or thoughtlessness of heart,

Sanskit Text: अरावा यो नो अभि दुछुनायते तस्मिन तदेनोवसवो नि धेतन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arāvā yo no abhi duchunāyate tasmin tadenovasavo ni dhetana ||
Translation: That guilt, O Vasus, lay upon the Evil One, on him who ever leads us into deep distress.

Sanskit Text: अस्मिन न इन्द्र पर्त्सुतौ यशस्वति शिमीवति करन्दसि परावसातये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmin na indra pṛtsutau yaśasvati śimīvati krandasi prāvasātaye |
Translation: 1. O INDRA, in this battle great and glorious, in this loud din of war help us to victory,

Sanskit Text: यत्र गोषाता धर्षितेषु खादिषु विष्वक्पतन्ति दिद्यवो नर्षाह्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatra ghoṣātā dhṛṣiteṣu khādiṣu viṣvakpatanti didyavo nṛṣāhye ||
Translation: Where in the strife for kine among bold ring-decked men arrows fly all around and heroes are subdued.

Sanskit Text: स नः कषुमन्तं सदने वयूर्णुहि गोर्णसं रयिमिन्द्रश्रवाय्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ kṣumantaṃ sadane vyūrṇuhi ghoarṇasaṃ rayimindraśravāyyam |
Translation: 2 At home disclose to us opulence rich in food, streaming with milk, O Indra, meet to be renowned.

Sanskit Text: सयाम ते जयतः शक्र मेदिनो यथा वयमुश्मसि तद वसो कर्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: syāma te jayataḥ śakra medino yathā vayamuśmasi tad vaso kṛdhi ||
Translation: Śakra, may we be thine, the friendly Conqueror's: even as we desire, O Vasu, so do thou.

Sanskit Text: यो नो दास आर्यो वा पुरुष्टुतादेव इन्द्र युधये चिकेतति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo no dāsa āryo vā puruṣṭutādeva indra yudhaye ciketati |
Translation: 3 The godless man, much-lauded Indra, whether he be Dāsa or be Ārya, who would war with us,—

Sanskit Text: अस्माभिष टे सुषहाः सन्तु शत्रवस्त्वया वयं तान्वनुयाम संगमे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmābhiṣ ṭe suṣahāḥ santu śatravastvayā vayaṃ tānvanuyāma saṃghame ||
Translation: Easy to conquer he for thee, with us, these foes: with thee may we subdue them in the clash of fight.

Sanskit Text: यो दभ्रेभिर्हव्यो यश्च भूरिभिर्यो अभीके वरिवोविन्न्र्षाह्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo dabhrebhirhavyo yaśca bhūribhiryo abhīke varivovinnṛṣāhye |
Translation: 4 Him who must be invoked by many and by few, who standeth nigh with comfort in the war of men,

Sanskit Text: तं विखादे सस्निमद्य शरुतं नरमर्वाञ्चमिन्द्रमवसे करामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vikhāde sasnimadya śrutaṃ naramarvāñcamindramavase karāmahe ||
Translation: Indra, famed Hero, winner in the deadly strife, let us bring hitherward to-day to favour us.

Sanskit Text: सवव्र्जं हि तवामहमिन्द्र शुश्रवानानुदं वर्षभरध्रचोदनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svavṛjaṃ hi tvāmahamindra śuśravānānudaṃ vṛṣabharadhracodanam |
Translation: 5 For, Indra, I have heard thee called Self. capturer, One, Steer! who never yields, who urges even the churl.

Sanskit Text: पर मुञ्चस्व परि कुत्सादिहा गहि किमुत्वावान मुष्कयोर्बद्ध आसते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra muñcasva pari kutsādihā ghahi kimutvāvān muṣkayorbaddha āsate ||
Translation: Release thyself from Kutsa and come hither. How shall one like thee sit still bound that he may not move?

Sanskit Text: यो वां परिज्मा सुव्र्दश्विना रथो दोषामुषासो हव्योहविष्मता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo vāṃ parijmā suvṛdaśvinā ratho doṣāmuṣāso havyohaviṣmatā |
Translation: 1. As ’twere the name of father, easy to invoke, we all assembled here invoke this Car of yours,

Sanskit Text: शश्वत्तमासस्तमु वामिदं वयं पितुर्ननाम सुहवं हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaśvattamāsastamu vāmidaṃ vayaṃ piturnanāma suhavaṃ havāmahe ||
Translation: Aśvins, your swiftly-rolling circumambient Car which he who worships must invoke at eve and dawn.

Sanskit Text: चोदयतं सून्र्ताः पिन्वतं धिय उत पुरन्धीरीरयतन्तदुश्मसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: codayataṃ sūnṛtāḥ pinvataṃ dhiya ut purandhīrīrayatantaduśmasi |
Translation: 2 Awake all pleasant strains and let the hymns flow forth: raise up abundant fulness: this is our desire.

Sanskit Text: यशसं भागं कर्णुतं नो अश्विना सोमं नचारुं मघवत्सु नस कर्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaśasaṃ bhāghaṃ kṛṇutaṃ no aśvinā somaṃ nacāruṃ maghavatsu nas kṛtam ||
Translation: Aśvins, bestow on us a glorious heritage, and give our princes treasure fair as Soma is.

Sanskit Text: अमाजुरश्चिद भवथो युवं भगो.अनाशोश्चिदवितारापमस्य चित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: amājuraścid bhavatho yuvaṃ bhagho.anāśościdavitārāpamasya cit |
Translation: 3 Ye are the bliss of her who groweth old at home, and helpers of the slow although he linger last.

Sanskit Text: अन्धस्य चिन नासत्या कर्शस्य चिद युवामिदाहुर्भिषजा रुतस्य चित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: andhasya cin nāsatyā kṛśasya cid yuvāmidāhurbhiṣajā rutasya cit ||
Translation: Men call you too, Nāsatyas, healers of the blind, the thin and feeble, and the man with broken bones.

Sanskit Text: युवं चयवानं सनयं यथा रथं पुनर्युवानंचरथाय तक्षथुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ cyavānaṃ sanayaṃ yathā rathaṃ punaryuvānaṃcarathāya takṣathuḥ |
Translation: 4 Ye made Cyavāna, weak and worn with length of days, young again, like a car, that he had power to move.

Sanskit Text: निष टौग्र्यमूहथुरद्भ्यस परिविश्वेत ता वां सवनेषु परवाच्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niṣ ṭaughryamūhathuradbhyas pariviśvet tā vāṃ savaneṣu pravācyā ||
Translation: Ye lifted up the son of Tugra from the floods. At our libations must all these your acts be praised.

Sanskit Text: पुराणा वां वीर्या पर बरवा जने.अथो हासथुर्भिषजामयोभुवा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purāṇā vāṃ vīryā pra bravā jane.atho hāsathurbhiṣajāmayobhuvā |
Translation: 5 We will declare among the folk your ancient deeds heroic; yea, ye were Physicians bringing health.

Sanskit Text: ता वां नु नव्याववसे करामहे.अयंनासत्या शरदरिर्यथा दधत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā vāṃ nu navyāvavase karāmahe.ayaṃnāsatyā śradariryathā dadhat ||
Translation: You, you who must be lauded, will we bring for aid, so that this foe of ours, O Aśvins, may believe.

Sanskit Text: इयं वामह्वे शर्णुतं मे अश्विना पुत्रायेव पितरा मह्यंशिक्षतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyaṃ vāmahve śṛṇutaṃ me aśvinā putrāyeva pitarā mahyaṃśikṣatam |
Translation: 6 Listen to me, O Aśvins; I have cried to you. Give me-your aid as sire and mother aid their son.

Sanskit Text: अनापिरज्ञा असजात्यामतिः पुरा तस्याभिशस्तेरव सप्र्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anāpirajñā asajātyāmatiḥ purā tasyāabhiśasterava spṛtam ||
Translation: Poor, without kin or friend or ties of blood am I. Save me before it be too late, from this my curse.

Sanskit Text: युवं रथेन विमदाय शुन्ध्युवं नयूहथुः पुरुमित्रस्ययोषणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ rathena vimadāya śundhyuvaṃ nyūhathuḥ purumitrasyayoṣaṇām |
Translation: 7 Ye, mounted on your chariot brought to Vimada the comely maid of Purumitra as a bride.

Sanskit Text: युवं हवं वध्रिमत्या अगछतं युवंसुषुतिं चक्रथुः पुरन्धये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ havaṃ vadhrimatyā aghachataṃ yuvaṃsuṣutiṃ cakrathuḥ purandhaye ||
Translation: Ye, came unto the calling of the weakling's dame, and granted noble offspring to the happy wife.

Sanskit Text: युवं विप्रस्य जरणामुपेयुषः पुनः कलेरक्र्णुतंयुवद वयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ viprasya jaraṇāmupeyuṣaḥ punaḥ kalerakṛṇutaṃyuvad vayaḥ |
Translation: 8 Ye gave a ain the vigour of his youthful life to tge sage Kali when old age was coming nigh.

Sanskit Text: युवं वन्दनं रश्यदादुदूपथुर्युवंसद्यो विश्पलामेतवे कर्थः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ vandanaṃ ṛśyadādudūpathuryuvaṃsadyo viśpalāmetave kṛthaḥ ||
Translation: Ye rescued Vandana and raised him from the pit, and in a moment gave Viśpalā power to move.

Sanskit Text: युवं ह रेभं वर्षणा गुहा हितमुदैरयतम्मम्र्वांसमश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ ha rebhaṃ vṛṣaṇā ghuhā hitamudairayatammamṛvāṃsamaśvinā |
Translation: 9 Ye Aśvins Twain, endowed with manly strength, brought forth Reblia when hidden in the cave and well-nigh dead,

Sanskit Text: युवं रबीसमुत तप्तमत्रयोमन्वन्तं चक्रथुः सप्तवध्रये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ ṛbīsamuta taptamatrayaomanvantaṃ cakrathuḥ saptavadhraye ||
Translation: Freed Saptavadliri, and for Atri caused the pit heated with fire to be a pleasant resting-place.

Sanskit Text: युवं शवेतं पेदवे.अश्विनाश्वं नवभिर्वाजैर्नवतीच वाजिनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ śvetaṃ pedave.aśvināśvaṃ navabhirvājairnavatīca vājinam |
Translation: 10 On Pedu ye bestowed, Aśvins, a courser white, mighty with nine-and-ninety varied gifts of strength,

Sanskit Text: चर्क्र्त्यं ददथुर्द्रावयत्सखं भगं नन्र्भ्यो हव्यं मयोभुबम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: carkṛtyaṃ dadathurdrāvayatsakhaṃ bhaghaṃ nanṛbhyo havyaṃ mayobhubam ||
Translation: A horse to be renowned, who bore his friend at speed, joy-giving, Bhaga-like to be invoked of men.

Sanskit Text: न तं राजानावदिते कुतश्चन नांहो अश्नोति दुरितंनकिर्भयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na taṃ rājānāvadite kutaścana nāṃho aśnoti duritaṃnakirbhayam |
Translation: 11 From no side, ye Two Kings whom none may check or stay, doth grief, distress, or danger come u on the man

Sanskit Text: यमश्विना सुहवा रुद्रवर्तनी पुरोरथंक्र्णुथः पत्न्या सह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamaśvinā suhavā rudravartanī purorathaṃkṛṇuthaḥ patnyā saha ||
Translation: Whom, Aśvins swift to hear, borne on your glowing path, ye with your Consort make the foremost in the race.

Sanskit Text: आ तेन यातं मनसो जवीयसा रथं यं वां रभवश्चक्रुरश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tena yātaṃ manaso javīyasā rathaṃ yaṃ vāṃ ṛbhavaścakruraśvinā |
Translation: 12 Come on that Chariot which the Ṛbhus wrought for you, the Chariot, Aśvins, that is speedier than thought,

Sanskit Text: यस्य योगे दुहिता जायते दिव उभे अहनीसुदिने विवस्वतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya yoghe duhitā jāyate diva ubhe ahanīsudine vivasvataḥ ||
Translation: At harnessing whereof Heaven's Daughter springs to birth, and from Vivasvān come auspicious Night and Day.

Sanskit Text: ता वर्तिर्यातं जयुषा वि पर्वतमपिन्वतं शयवेधेनुमश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā vartiryātaṃ jayuṣā vi parvatamapinvataṃ śayavedhenumaśvinā |
Translation: 13 Come, Conquerors of the sundered mountain, to our home, Aśvins who made the cow stream milk for Śayu's sake,

Sanskit Text: वर्कस्य चिद वर्तिकामन्तरास्याद युवंशचीभिर्ग्रसिताममुञ्चतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛkasya cid vartikāmantarāsyād yuvaṃśacībhirghrasitāmamuñcatam ||
Translation: Ye who delivered even from the wolf's deep throat and set again at liberty the swallowed quail.

Sanskit Text: एतं वां सतोममश्विनावकर्मातक्षाम भर्गवो न रथम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etaṃ vāṃ stomamaśvināvakarmātakṣāma bhṛghavo na ratham |
Translation: 14 We have prepared this laud for you, O Aśvins, and, like the Bhṛgus, as a car have framed it,

Sanskit Text: नयम्र्क्षाम योषणां न मर्ये नित्यं न सूनुन्तनयं दधानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nyamṛkṣāma yoṣaṇāṃ na marye nityaṃ na sūnuntanayaṃ dadhānāḥ ||
Translation: Have decked it as a maid to meet the bridegroom, and brought it as a son, our stay for ever.

Sanskit Text: रथं यान्तं कुह को ह वां नरा परति दयुमन्तंसुविताय भूषति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathaṃ yāntaṃ kuha ko ha vāṃ narā prati dyumantaṃsuvitāya bhūṣati |
Translation: 1. YOUR radiant Chariot-whither goes it on its way?-who decks it for you, Heroes, for its happy course,

Sanskit Text: परातर्यावाणं विभ्वं विशे-विशेवस्तोर वस्तोर्वहमानं धिया शमि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātaryāvāṇaṃ vibhvaṃ viśe-viśevastor vastorvahamānaṃ dhiyā śami ||
Translation: Starting at daybreak, visiting each morning every house, borne hitherward through prayer unto the sacrifice?

Sanskit Text: कुह सविद दोषा कुह वस्तोरश्विना कुहाभिपित्वं करतःकुहोषतुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kuha svid doṣā kuha vastoraśvinā kuhābhipitvaṃ karataḥkuhoṣatuḥ |
Translation: 2 Where are ye, Aśvins, in the evening, where at morn? Where is your haltingplace, where rest ye for the night?

Sanskit Text: को वां शयुत्रा विधवेव देवरं मर्यं नयोषा कर्णुते सधस्थ आ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko vāṃ śayutrā vidhaveva devaraṃ maryaṃ nayoṣā kṛṇute sadhastha ā ||
Translation: Who brings you homeward, as the widow bedward draws her husband's brother, as the bride attracts the groom?

Sanskit Text: परातर्जरेथे जरणेव कापया वस्तोर-वस्तोर्यजता गछथोग्र्हम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātarjarethe jaraṇeva kāpayā vastor-vastoryajatā ghachathoghṛham |
Translation: 3 Early ye sing forth praise as with a herald's voice, and, meet for worship, go each morning to the house.

Sanskit Text: कस्य धवस्रा भवथः कस्य वा नरा राजपुत्रेवसवनाव गछथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kasya dhvasrā bhavathaḥ kasya vā narā rājaputrevasavanāva ghachathaḥ ||
Translation: Whom do ye ever bring to ruin? Unto whose libations come ye, Heroes, like two Sons of Kings?

Sanskit Text: युवां मर्गेव वारणा मर्गण्यवो दोषा वस्तोर्हविषा निह्वयामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvāṃ mṛgheva vāraṇā mṛghaṇyavo doṣā vastorhaviṣā nihvayāmahe |
Translation: 4 Even as hunters follow two wild elephants, we with oblations call you down at morn and eve.

Sanskit Text: युवं होत्रां रतुथा जुह्वते नरेषं जनायवहथः शुभस पती ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ hotrāṃ ṛtuthā juhvate nareṣaṃ janāyavahathaḥ śubhas patī ||
Translation: To folk who pay you offierings at appointed times, Chiefs, Lords of splendour, ye bring food to strengthen them.

Sanskit Text: युवां ह घोषा पर्यश्विना यती राज्ञ ऊचे दुहिताप्र्छे वां नरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvāṃ ha ghoṣā paryaśvinā yatī rājña ūce duhitāpṛche vāṃ narā |
Translation: 5 To you, O Aśvins, came the daughter of a King, Ghoṣā, and said, O Heroes, this I beg of you:

Sanskit Text: भूतं मे अह्न उत भूतमक्तवेऽशवावते रथिने शक्तमर्वते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūtaṃ me ahna uta bhūtamaktave'śvāvate rathine śaktamarvate ||
Translation: Be near me in the day, he near me in the night: help me to gain a car-borne chieftain rich in steeds.

Sanskit Text: युवं कवी षठः पर्यश्विना रथं विशो न कुत्सोजरितुर्नशायथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ kavī ṣṭhaḥ paryaśvinā rathaṃ viśo na kutsojariturnaśāyathaḥ |
Translation: 6 O Aśvins, ye are wise: as Kutsa comes to men, bring your car nigh the folk of him who sings your praise.

Sanskit Text: युवोर्ह मक्षा पर्यश्विना मध्वासा भरत निष्क्र्तं न योषणा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvorha makṣā paryaśvinā madhvāsā bharata niṣkṛtaṃ na yoṣaṇā ||
Translation: The bee, O Aśvins, bears your honey in her mouth, as the maid carries it purified in her hand.

Sanskit Text: युवं ह भुज्युं युवमश्विना वशं युवं शिञ्जारमुशनामुपारथुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ ha bhujyuṃ yuvamaśvinā vaśaṃ yuvaṃ śiñjāramuśanāmupārathuḥ |
Translation: 7 To Bhujyu and to Vaśa ye come near with help, O Aśvins, to Sinjara and to Uśanā.

Sanskit Text: युवो ररावा परि सख्यमासते युवोरहमवसा सुम्नमा चके ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvo rarāvā pari sakhyamāsate yuvorahamavasā sumnamā cake ||
Translation: Your worshipper secures your friendship for himself. Through your protection I desire felicity.

Sanskit Text: युवं ह कर्शं युवमश्विना शयुं युवं विधन्तंविधवामुरुष्यथः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ ha kṛśaṃ yuvamaśvinā śayuṃ yuvaṃ vidhantaṃvidhavāmuruṣyathaḥ |
Translation: 8 Krsa and Śayu ye protect, ye Aśvins Twain: ye Two assist the widow and the worshipper;

Sanskit Text: युवं सनिभ्य सतनयन्तमश्विनापव्रजमूर्णुथः सप्तास्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ sanibhya stanayantamaśvināpavrajamūrṇuthaḥ saptāsyam ||
Translation: And ye throw open, Aśvins, unto those who win the cattle-stall that thunders with its serenfold mouth.

Sanskit Text: जनिष्ट योषा पतयत कनीनको वि चारुहन वीरुधोदंसना अनु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: janiṣṭa yoṣā patayat kanīnako vi cāruhan vīrudhodaṃsanā anu |
Translation: 9 The Woman hath brought forth, the Infant hath appeared, the plants of wondrous beauty straightway have sprung up.

Sanskit Text: आस्मै रीयन्ते निवनेव सिन्धवो.अस्मा अह्नेभवति तत पतित्वनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsmai rīyante nivaneva sindhavo.asmā ahnebhavati tat patitvanam ||
Translation: To him the rivers run as down a deep descent, and he this day becomes their master and their lord.

Sanskit Text: जीवं रुदन्ति वि मयन्ते अध्वरे दीर्घामनु परसितिन्दीधियुर्नरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jīvaṃ rudanti vi mayante adhvare dīrghāmanu prasitindīdhiyurnaraḥ |
Translation: 10 They mourn the living, cry aloud, at sacrifice: the men have set their thoughts upon a distant cast.

Sanskit Text: वामं पित्र्भ्यो य इदं समेरिरे मयःपतिभ्यो जनयः परिष्वजे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāmaṃ pitṛbhyo ya idaṃ samerire mayaḥpatibhyo janayaḥ pariṣvaje ||
Translation: A lovely thing for fathers who have gathered here,—a joy to husbands,—are the wives their arms shall clasp

Sanskit Text: न तस्य विद्म तदु षु पर वोचत युवा ह यद युवत्याःक्षेति योनिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na tasya vidma tadu ṣu pra vocata yuvā ha yad yuvatyāḥkṣeti yoniṣu |
Translation: 11 Of this we have no knowledge. Tall it forth to us, now the youth rests within the chambers of the bride.

Sanskit Text: परियोस्रियस्य वर्षभस्य रेतिनो गर्हंगमेमाश्विना तदुश्मसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyosriyasya vṛṣabhasya retino ghṛhaṃghamemāśvinā taduśmasi ||
Translation: Fain would we reach the dwelling of the vigorous Steer who loves the kine, O Aśvins: this is our desire.

Sanskit Text: आ वामगन सुमतिर्वाजिनीवसू नयश्विना हर्त्सु कामायंसत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāmaghan sumatirvājinīvasū nyaśvinā hṛtsu kāmāayaṃsata |
Translation: 12 Your favouring grace hath come, ye Lords of ample wealth: Aśvins, our longings are stored up within your hearts.

Sanskit Text: अभूतं गोपा मिथुना शुभस पती परियार्यम्णो दुर्यानशीमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhūtaṃ ghopā mithunā śubhas patī priyāaryamṇo duryānaśīmahi ||
Translation: Ye, Lords of splendour, have become our twofold guard: may we as welcome friends reach Aryaman's abode.

Sanskit Text: ता मन्दसाना मनुषो दुरोण आ धत्तं रयिं सहवीरंवचस्यवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā mandasānā manuṣo duroṇa ā dhattaṃ rayiṃ sahavīraṃvacasyave |
Translation: 13 Even so, rejoicing in the dwelling-place of man, give hero sons and riches to the eloquent.

Sanskit Text: कर्तं तीर्थं सुप्रपाणं शुभस पतीस्थाणुं पथेष्ठामप दुर्मतिं हतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛtaṃ tīrthaṃ suprapāṇaṃ śubhas patīsthāṇuṃ patheṣṭhāmapa durmatiṃ hatam ||
Translation: Make a ford, Lords of splendour, where men well may drink: remove the spiteful tree-stump standing in the path.

Sanskit Text: कव सविदद्य कतमास्वश्विना विक्षु दस्रा मादयेतेशुभस पती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kva svidadya katamāsvaśvinā vikṣu dasrā mādayeteśubhas patī |
Translation: 14 O Aśvins, Wonder-Workers, Lords of lustre, where and with what folk do ye delight yourselves to-day?

Sanskit Text: क ईं नि येमे कतमस्य जग्मतुर्विप्रस्य वायजमानस्य वा गर्हम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ka īṃ ni yeme katamasya jaghmaturviprasya vāyajamānasya vā ghṛham ||
Translation: Who hath detained them with him? Whither are they gone? Unto what sage's or what worshipper's abode?

Sanskit Text: समानमु तयं पुरुहूतमुक्थ्यं रथं तरिचक्रं सवनागनिग्मतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samānamu tyaṃ puruhūtamukthyaṃ rathaṃ tricakraṃ savanāghanighmatam |
Translation: 1. THAT general Car of yours, invoked by many a man, that comes to our libations, three-wheeled, meet for lauds,

Sanskit Text: परिज्मानं विदथ्यं सुव्र्क्तिभिर्वयंव्युष्टा उषसो हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parijmānaṃ vidathyaṃ suvṛktibhirvayaṃvyuṣṭā uṣaso havāmahe ||
Translation: That circumambient Car, worthy of sacrifice, we call with our pure hymns at earliest flush of dawn.

Sanskit Text: परातर्युजं नासत्याधि तिष्ठथः परातर्यावाणम्मधुवाहनं रथम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātaryujaṃ nāsatyādhi tiṣṭhathaḥ prātaryāvāṇammadhuvāhanaṃ ratham |
Translation: 2 Ye, O Nāsatyas, mount that early-harnessed Car, that travels early, laden with its freight of balm,

Sanskit Text: विशो येन गछथो यज्वरीर्नराकीरेश्चिद यज्ञं होत्र्मन्तमश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśo yena ghachatho yajvarīrnarākīreścid yajñaṃ hotṛmantamaśvinā ||
Translation: Wherewith ye, Heroes, visit clans who sacrifice, even the poor man's worship where the priest attends.

Sanskit Text: अध्वर्युं वा मधुपाणिं सुहस्त्यमग्निधं वाध्र्तदक्षं दमूनसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhvaryuṃ vā madhupāṇiṃ suhastyamaghnidhaṃ vādhṛtadakṣaṃ damūnasam |
Translation: 3 If to the deft Adhvaryu with the meath in hand, or to the Kindler firm in strength, the household friend,

Sanskit Text: विप्रस्य वा यत सवननि गछथोऽत आ यातं मधुपेयमश्विना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viprasya vā yat savanani ghachatho'ta ā yātaṃ madhupeyamaśvinā ||
