Translation: Or to the sage's poured libations ye approach, come thence, O Aśvins, now to drink the offered meath.

Sanskit Text: अस्तेव सु परतरं लायमस्यन भूषन्निव पर भरास्तोममस्मै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asteva su prataraṃ lāyamasyan bhūṣanniva pra bharāstomamasmai |
Translation: 1. EVEN as an archer shoots afar his arrow, offer the laud to him with meet adornment.

Sanskit Text: वाचा विप्रास्तरत वाचमर्यो नि रामयजरितः सोम इन्द्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vācā viprāstarata vācamaryo ni rāmayajaritaḥ soma indram ||
Translation: Quell with your voice the wicked's voice, O sages. Singer, make Indra rest beside the Soma.

Sanskit Text: दोहेन गामुप शिक्षा सखायं पर बोधय जरितर्जारमिन्द्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dohena ghāmupa śikṣā sakhāyaṃ pra bodhaya jaritarjāramindram |
Translation: 2 Draw thy Friend to thee like a cow at milking: O Singer, wake up Indra as a lover.

Sanskit Text: कोशं न पूर्णं वसुना नय्र्ष्टमा चयावयमघदेयाय शूरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kośaṃ na pūrṇaṃ vasunā nyṛṣṭamā cyāvayamaghadeyāya śūram ||
Translation: Make thou the Hero haste to give us riches even as a vessel filled brimful with treasure.

Sanskit Text: किमङग तवा मघवन भोजमाहुः शिशीहि मा शिशयन्त्वा शर्णोमि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kimaṅgha tvā maghavan bhojamāhuḥ śiśīhi mā śiśayantvā śṛṇomi |
Translation: 3 Why, Maghavan, do they call thee Bounteous; Giver? Quicken me: thou, I hear, art he who quickens.

Sanskit Text: अप्नस्वती मम धीरस्तु शक्र वसुविदम्भगमिन्द्रा भरा नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apnasvatī mama dhīrastu śakra vasuvidambhaghamindrā bharā naḥ ||
Translation: Śakra, let my intelligence be active, and bring us luck that finds great wealth, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: तवां जना ममसत्येष्विन्द्र सन्तस्थाना वि हवयन्तेसमीके |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ janā mamasatyeṣvindra santasthānā vi hvayantesamīke |
Translation: 4 Standing, in battle for their rights, together, the people, Indra, in the fray invoke thee.

Sanskit Text: अत्रा युजं कर्णुते यो हविष्मान नासुन्वतासख्यं वष्टि शूरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrā yujaṃ kṛṇute yo haviṣmān nāsunvatāsakhyaṃ vaṣṭi śūraḥ ||
Translation: Him who brings gifts the Hero makes his comrade: with him who pours no juice he seeks not friendship.

Sanskit Text: धनं न सयन्द्रं बहुलं यो अस्मै तीव्रान सोमानासुनोतिप्रयस्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhanaṃ na syandraṃ bahulaṃ yo asmai tīvrān somānāsunotiprayasvān |
Translation: 5 Whoso with plenteous food for him expresses strong Somas as much quickly-coming treasure,

Sanskit Text: तस्मै शत्रून सुतुकान परातरह्नो निस्वष्ट्रान युवति हन्ति वर्त्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmai śatrūn sutukān prātarahno nisvaṣṭrān yuvati hanti vṛtram ||
Translation: For him he overthrows in early morning his swift well-weaponed foes, and slays the tyrant.

Sanskit Text: यस्मिन वयं दधिमा शंसमिन्द्रे यः शिश्राय मघवाकाममस्मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasmin vayaṃ dadhimā śaṃsamindre yaḥ śiśrāya maghavākāmamasme |
Translation: 6 He unto whom we offer praises, Indra, Maghavan, who hath joined to ours his wishes,—

Sanskit Text: आराच्चित सन भयतामस्य शत्रुर्न्यस्मैद्युम्ना जन्या नमन्ताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ārāccit san bhayatāmasya śatrurnyasmaidyumnā janyā namantām ||
Translation: Before him even afar the foe must tremble: low before him must bow all human glories.

Sanskit Text: आराच्छत्रुमप बाधस्व दूरमुग्रो यः शम्बःपुरुहूत तेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ārācchatrumapa bādhasva dūramughro yaḥ śambaḥpuruhūta tena |
Translation: 7 With thy fierce bolt, O God invoked of many, drive to a distance from afar the foeman.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे धेहि यवमद गोमदिन्द्र कर्धी धियंजरित्रे वाजरत्नाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme dhehi yavamad ghomadindra kṛdhī dhiyaṃjaritre vājaratnām ||
Translation: O Indra, give us wealth in corn and cattle, and make thy singer's prayer gain strength and riches.

Sanskit Text: पर यमन्तर्व्र्षसवासो अग्मन तीव्राः सोमा बहुलान्तासैन्द्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yamantarvṛṣasavāso aghman tīvrāḥ somā bahulāntāsaindram |
Translation: 8 Indra, the swallower of strong libations rich in the boons they bring, the potent Somas,

Sanskit Text: नाह दामानं मघवा नि यंसन नि सुन्वते वहतिभूरि वामम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāha dāmānaṃ maghavā ni yaṃsan ni sunvate vahatibhūri vāmam ||
Translation: He, Maghavan, will not restrict his bounty he brings much wealth unto the Soma-presser.

Sanskit Text: उत परहामतिदीव्या जयाति कर्तं यच्छ्वघ्नी विचिनोतिकाले |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta prahāmatidīvyā jayāti kṛtaṃ yacchvaghnī vicinotikāle |
Translation: 9 Yea, by superior play he wins advantage, when he, a gambler, piles his gains in season.

Sanskit Text: यो देवकामो न धना रुणद्धि समित तं रायास्र्जति सवधावान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo devakāmo na dhanā ruṇaddhi samit taṃ rāyāsṛjati svadhāvān ||
Translation: Celestial-natured, he o’erwhelms with riches the devotee who keeps not back his treasure.

Sanskit Text: गोभिष टरेमामतिं दुरेवां यवेन कषुधं पुरुहूतविश्वाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghobhiṣ ṭaremāmatiṃ durevāṃ yavena kṣudhaṃ puruhūtaviśvām |
Translation: 10 O Much-invoked, may we subdue all famine and evil want with store of grain and cattle.

Sanskit Text: वयं राजभिः परथमा धनान्यस्माकेनव्र्जनेना जयेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ rājabhiḥ prathamā dhanānyasmākenavṛjanenā jayema ||
Translation: May we allied, as first in rank, with princes obtain possessions by our own exertion.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिर्नः परि पातु पश्चादुतोत्तरस्मादधरादघायोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatirnaḥ pari pātu paścādutottarasmādadharādaghāyoḥ |
Translation: 11 Bṛhaspati protect us from the rearward, and from above, and from below, from sinners!

Sanskit Text: इद्रः पुरस्तादुत मध्यतो नः सखा सखिभ्योवरिवः कर्णोतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: idraḥ purastāduta madhyato naḥ sakhā sakhibhyovarivaḥ kṛṇotu ||
Translation: May Indra from the front, and from the centre, as Friend to friends, vouchsafe us room and freedom.

Sanskit Text: दिवस परि परथमं जज्ञे अग्निरस्मद दवितीयं परिजातवेदाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divas pari prathamaṃ jajñe aghnirasmad dvitīyaṃ parijātavedāḥ |
Translation: 1. FIRST Agni sprang to life from out of Heaven: the second time from us came Jātavedas.

Sanskit Text: तर्तीयमप्सु नर्मणा अजस्रमिन्धान एनंजरते सवाधीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tṛtīyamapsu nṛmaṇā ajasramindhāna enaṃjarate svādhīḥ ||
Translation: Thirdly the Manly-souled was in the waters. The pious lauds and kindles him the Eternal.

Sanskit Text: विद्मा ते अग्ने तरेधा तरयाणि विद्मा ते धाम विभ्र्तापुरुत्रा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidmā te aghne tredhā trayāṇi vidmā te dhāma vibhṛtāpurutrā |
Translation: 2 Agni, we know thy three powers in three stations, we know thy forms in many a place divided.

Sanskit Text: विद्मा ते नाम परमं गुहा यद विद्मा तमुत्सं यत आजगन्थ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidmā te nāma paramaṃ ghuhā yad vidmā tamutsaṃ yata ājaghantha ||
Translation: We know what name supreme thou hast in secret: we know the source from which thou hast proceeded.

Sanskit Text: समुद्रे तवा नर्मणा अप्स्वन्तर्न्र्चक्षा ईधे दिवो अग्नूधन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samudre tvā nṛmaṇā apsvantarnṛcakṣā īdhe divo aghnaūdhan |
Translation: 3 The Manly-souled lit thee in sea and waters, man's Viewer lit thee in the breast of heaven,

Sanskit Text: तर्तीये तवा रजसि तस्थिवांसमपामुपस्थेमहिषा अवर्धन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tṛtīye tvā rajasi tasthivāṃsamapāmupasthemahiṣā avardhan ||
Translation: There as thou stoodest in the third high region the Steers increased thee in the water's bosom.

Sanskit Text: अक्रन्ददग्नि सतनयन्निव दयौः कषामा रेरिहद वीरुधःसमञ्जन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: akrandadaghni stanayanniva dyauḥ kṣāmā rerihad vīrudhaḥsamañjan |
Translation: 4 Agni roared out, like Dyaus what time he thunders: he licked the ground about the plants he flickered.

Sanskit Text: सद्यो जज्ञानो वि हीमिद्धो अख्यदा रोदसीभानुना भात्यन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadyo jajñāno vi hīmiddho akhyadā rodasībhānunā bhātyantaḥ ||
Translation: At once, when born, he looked around enkindled, and lightened heaven and earth within with splendour.

Sanskit Text: शरीणामुदारो धरुणो रयीणां मनीषाणाम्प्रार्पणः सोमगोपाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrīṇāmudāro dharuṇo rayīṇāṃ manīṣāṇāmprārpaṇaḥ somaghopāḥ |
Translation: 5 The spring of glories and support of riches, rouser of thoughts and guardian of the Soma,

Sanskit Text: वसुः सूनुः सहसो अप्सु राजावि भात्यग्र उषसामिधानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasuḥ sūnuḥ sahaso apsu rājāvi bhātyaghra uṣasāmidhānaḥ ||
Translation: Good Son of Strength, a King amid the waters, in forefront of the Dawns he shines enkindled.

Sanskit Text: विश्वस्य केतुर्भुवनस्य गर्भ आ रोदसी अप्र्णाज्जायमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvasya keturbhuvanasya gharbha ā rodasī apṛṇājjāyamānaḥ |
Translation: 6 Germ of the world, ensign of all creation, be sprang to life and filled the earth and heavens.

Sanskit Text: वीळुं चिदद्रिमभिनत परायञ जना यदग्निमयजन्त पञ्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vīḷuṃ cidadrimabhinat parāyañ janā yadaghnimayajanta pañca ||
Translation: Even the firm rock he cleft when passing over, when the Five Tribes brought sacrifice to Agni.

Sanskit Text: उशिक पावको अरतिः सुमेधा मर्तेष्वग्निरम्र्तो नि धायि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uśik pāvako aratiḥ sumedhā marteṣvaghniramṛto ni dhāyi |
Translation: 7 So among mortals was Immortal Agni stablished as holy wise and willing envoy.

Sanskit Text: इयर्ति धूममरुषं भरिभ्रदुच्छुक्रेण शोचिषाद्या इनक्षन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyarti dhūmamaruṣaṃ bharibhraducchukreṇa śociṣādyā inakṣan ||
Translation: He waves the red smoke that he lifts above him, striving to reach the heavens with radiant lustre.

Sanskit Text: दर्शानो रुक्म उर्विया वयद्यौद दुर्मर्षमायुः शरियेरुचानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dṛśāno rukma urviyā vyadyaud durmarṣamāyuḥ śriyerucānaḥ |
Translation: 8 Like gold to look on, far he shone refulgent, beaming imperishable life for glory,

Sanskit Text: अग्निरम्र्तो अभवद वयोभिर्यदेनं दयौर्जनयत सुरेताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniramṛto abhavad vayobhiryadenaṃ dyaurjanayat suretāḥ ||
Translation: Agni by vital powers became immortal when his prolific Father Dyaus begat him.

Sanskit Text: यस्ते अद्य कर्णवद भद्रशोचे.अपूपं देव घर्तवन्तमग्ने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaste adya kṛṇavad bhadraśoce.apūpaṃ deva ghṛtavantamaghne |
Translation: 9 Whoso this day, O God whose flames are lovely, prepares a cake, O Agni, mixt with butter,

Sanskit Text: पर तं नय परतरं वस्यो अछाभि सुम्नं देवभक्तंयविष्ठ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra taṃ naya prataraṃ vasyo achābhi sumnaṃ devabhaktaṃyaviṣṭha ||
Translation: Lead thou and further him to higher fortune, to bliss bestowed by Gods, O thou Most Youthful.

Sanskit Text: आ तं भज सौश्रवसेष्वग्न उक्थौक्थ आ भज शस्यमाने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā taṃ bhaja sauśravaseṣvaghna ukthauktha ā bhaja śasyamāne |
Translation: 10 Endow him, Agni, with a share of glory, at every song of praise sung forth enrich him.

Sanskit Text: परियः सूर्ये परियो अग्ना भवात्युज्जातेन भिनददुज्जनित्वैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyaḥ sūrye priyo aghnā bhavātyujjātena bhinadadujjanitvaiḥ ||
Translation: Dear let him be to Sūrya, dear to Agni, preeminent with son and children's children.

Sanskit Text: तवामग्ने यजमाना अनु दयून विश्वा वसु दधिरे वार्याणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmaghne yajamānā anu dyūn viśvā vasu dadhire vāryāṇi |
Translation: 11 While, Agni, day by day men pay thee worship they win themselves all treasures worth the wishing.

Sanskit Text: तवया सह दरविणमिछमाना वरजं गोमन्तमुशिजो विवव्रुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā saha draviṇamichamānā vrajaṃ ghomantamuśijo vivavruḥ ||
Translation: Allied with thee, eager and craving riches, they have disclosed the stable filled with cattle.

Sanskit Text: अस्ताव्यग्निर्नरां सुशेवो वैश्वानर रषिभिःसोमगोपाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: astāvyaghnirnarāṃ suśevo vaiśvānara ṛṣibhiḥsomaghopāḥ |
Translation: 12 Agni, the Friend of men, the Soma's keeper, Vaiśvānara, hath been lauded by the Ṛṣis.

Sanskit Text: अद्वेषे दयावाप्र्थिवी हुवेम देवा धत्त रयिमस्मे सुवीरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adveṣe dyāvāpṛthivī huvema devā dhatta rayimasme suvīram ||
Translation: We will invoke benignant Earth and Heaven: ye Deities, give us wealth with hero children.

Sanskit Text: पर होता जातो महान नभोविन नर्षद्वा सीददपामुपस्थे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra hotā jāto mahān nabhovin nṛṣadvā sīdadapāmupasthe |
Translation: 1. STABLISHED for thee, to lend thee vital forces, Giver of wealth, Guard of his servant's body.

Sanskit Text: दधिर्यो धायि स ते वयांसि यन्ता वसूनि विधतेतनूपाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhiryo dhāyi sa te vayāṃsi yantā vasūni vidhatetanūpāḥ ||
Translation: The Great Priest, born, who knows the clouds, Abider with men, is seated in the lap of waters.

Sanskit Text: इमं विधन्तो अपां सधस्थे पशुं न नष्टं पदैरनु गमन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ vidhanto apāṃ sadhasthe paśuṃ na naṣṭaṃ padairanu ghman |
Translation: 2 Worshipping, seeking him with adoration like some lost creature followed by its footprints,

Sanskit Text: गुहा चतन्तमुशिजो नमोभिरिछन्तो धीराभ्र्गवो.अविन्दन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghuhā catantamuśijo namobhirichanto dhīrābhṛghavo.avindan ||
Translation: Wise Bhṛgus, yearning in their hearts, pursued him, and found him lurking where the floods are gathered.

Sanskit Text: इमं तरितो भूर्यविन्ददिछन वैभूवसो मूर्धन्यघ्न्यायाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ trito bhūryavindadichan vaibhūvaso mūrdhanyaghnyāyāḥ |
Translation: 3 On the Cow's forehead, with laborious searching, Trita, the offspring of Vibhiavas, found him.

Sanskit Text: स शेव्र्धो जात आ हर्म्येषु नाभिर्युवाभवति रोचनस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa śevṛdho jāta ā harmyeṣu nābhiryuvābhavati rocanasya ||
Translation: Born in our houses, Youthful, joy-bestower, he now becomes the central point of brightness.

Sanskit Text: मन्द्रं होतारमुशिजो नमोभिः पराञ्चं यज्ञं नेतारमध्वराणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mandraṃ hotāramuśijo namobhiḥ prāñcaṃ yajñaṃ netāramadhvarāṇām |
Translation: 4 Yearning, with homage, they have set and made him blithe Priest among mankind, oblation-bearer,

Sanskit Text: विशामक्र्ण्वन्नरतिं पावकं हव्यवाहन्दधतो मानुषेषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśāmakṛṇvannaratiṃ pāvakaṃ havyavāhandadhato mānuṣeṣu ||
Translation: Leader of rites and Purifier, envoy of men, as sacrifice that still advances.

Sanskit Text: पर भूर्जयन्तं महां विपोधां मूरा अमूरं पुरान्दर्माणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra bhūrjayantaṃ mahāṃ vipodhāṃ mūrā amūraṃ purāndarmāṇam |
Translation: 5 The foolish brought the ne’er-bewildered forward, great, Victor, Song-inspirer, Fort-destroyer.

Sanskit Text: नयन्तो गर्भं वनां धियं धुर्हिरिश्मश्रुं नार्वाणं धनर्चम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nayanto gharbhaṃ vanāṃ dhiyaṃ dhurhiriśmaśruṃ nārvāṇaṃ dhanarcam ||
Translation: Leading the Youth gold-bearded, like a courser gleaming with wealth, they turned their hymn to profit.

Sanskit Text: नि पस्त्यासु तरित सतभूयन परिवीतो योनौ सीददन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni pastyāsu trita stabhūyan parivīto yonau sīdadantaḥ |
Translation: 6 Holding his station firmly in the houses, Trita sat down within his home surrounded

Sanskit Text: अतः संग्र्भ्या विशां दमूना विधर्मणायन्त्रैरीयतेनॄन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ataḥ saṃghṛbhyā viśāṃ damūnā vidharmaṇāyantrairīyatenṝn ||
Translation: Thence, as Law bids, departs the Tribes' Companion having collected men with no compulsion.

Sanskit Text: अस्याजरासो दमामरित्रा अर्चद्धूमासो अग्नयः पावकाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asyājarāso damāmaritrā arcaddhūmāso aghnayaḥ pāvakāḥ |
Translation: 7 His are the fires, eternal, purifying, that make the houses move, whose smoke is shining,

Sanskit Text: शवितीचयः शवात्रासो भुरण्यवो वनर्षदो वायवो नसोमाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śvitīcayaḥ śvātrāso bhuraṇyavo vanarṣado vāyavo nasomāḥ ||
Translation: White, waxing in their strength, for ever stirring, and sitting in the wood; like winds are Somas.

Sanskit Text: पर जिह्वया भरते वेपो अग्निः पर वयुनानि चेतसाप्र्थिव्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra jihvayā bharate vepo aghniḥ pra vayunāni cetasāpṛthivyāḥ |
Translation: 8 The tongue of Agni bears away the praisesong, and, through his care for Earth, her operations.

Sanskit Text: तमायवः शुचयन्तं पावकं मन्द्रंहोतारं दधिरे यजिष्ठम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamāyavaḥ śucayantaṃ pāvakaṃ mandraṃhotāraṃ dadhire yajiṣṭham ||
Translation: Him, bright and radiant, living men have stablished as their blithe Priest, the Chief of Sacrificers.

Sanskit Text: दयावा यमग्निं पर्थिवी जनिष्टामापस्त्वष्टा भर्गवोयं सहोभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyāvā yamaghniṃ pṛthivī janiṣṭāmāpastvaṣṭā bhṛghavoyaṃ sahobhiḥ |
Translation: 9 That Agni, him whom Heaven and Earth engendered, the Waters. Tvaṣṭar, and with might, the Bhṛgus,

Sanskit Text: ईळेन्यं परथमं मातरिश्वा देवास्ततक्षुर्मनवे यजत्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: īḷenyaṃ prathamaṃ mātariśvā devāstatakṣurmanave yajatram ||
Translation: Him Mātariśvan and the Gods have fashioned holy for man and first to be entreated.

Sanskit Text: यं तवा देवा दधिरे हव्यवाहं पुरुस्प्र्हो मानुषासोयजत्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ tvā devā dadhire havyavāhaṃ puruspṛho mānuṣāsoyajatram |
Translation: 10 Agni, whom Gods have made oblationbearer, and much-desiring men regard as holy,

Sanskit Text: स यामन्नग्ने सतुवते वयो धाः पर देवयन्यशसः सं हि पूर्वीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa yāmannaghne stuvate vayo dhāḥ pra devayanyaśasaḥ saṃ hi pūrvīḥ ||
Translation: Give life to him who lauds thee when he worships, and then shall glorious men in troops adore thee.

Sanskit Text: जग्र्भ्मा ते दक्षिणमिन्द्र हस्तं वसूयवो वसुपतेवसूनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jaghṛbhmā te dakṣiṇamindra hastaṃ vasūyavo vasupatevasūnām |
Translation: 1. THY right hand have we grasped in ours, O Indra, longing for treasure, Treasure-Lord of treasures!

Sanskit Text: विद्मा हि तवा गोपतिं शूर गोनामस्मभ्यंचित्रं वर्षणं रयिं दाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidmā hi tvā ghopatiṃ śūra ghonāmasmabhyaṃcitraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ ||
Translation: Because we know thee, Hero, Lord of cattle: vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

Sanskit Text: सवायुधं सववसं सुनीथं चतुःसमुद्रं धरुनंरयीणाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāyudhaṃ svavasaṃ sunīthaṃ catuḥsamudraṃ dharunaṃrayīṇām |
Translation: 2 Wealth, fully armed, good guard and kind protector, sprung from four seas, the prop and stay of treasures,

Sanskit Text: चर्क्र्त्यं शंस्यं भूरिवारमस्मभ्यंचित्रं वर्षणं रयिं दाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: carkṛtyaṃ śaṃsyaṃ bhūrivāramasmabhyaṃcitraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ ||
Translation: Fraught with great bounties, meet for praise and glory; vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

Sanskit Text: सुब्रह्माणं देववन्तं बर्हन्तमुरुं गभीरं पर्थुबुध्नमिन्द्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: subrahmāṇaṃ devavantaṃ bṛhantamuruṃ ghabhīraṃ pṛthubudhnamindra |
Translation: 3 Wealth, with good Brahmans, Indra! God-attended, high, wide, and deep, arid based on broad foundations,

Sanskit Text: शरुतर्षिमुग्रमभिमातिषाहमस्मभ्यं चित्रंव्र्षणं रयिं दाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrutaṛṣimughramabhimātiṣāhamasmabhyaṃ citraṃvṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ ||
Translation: Strong, with famed Ṛṣis, conquering our foemen: vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

Sanskit Text: सनद्वाजं विप्रवीरं तरुत्रं धनस्प्र्तं शूशुवांसंसुदक्षम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanadvājaṃ vipravīraṃ tarutraṃ dhanaspṛtaṃ śūśuvāṃsaṃsudakṣam |
Translation: 4 Victorious, winning strength, with hero sages, confirmed in power, most useful, wealth-attracting,

Sanskit Text: दस्युहनं पूर्भिदमिन्द्र सत्यमस्मभ्यंचित्रं वर्षणं रयिं दाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dasyuhanaṃ pūrbhidamindra satyamasmabhyaṃcitraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ ||
Translation: True, Indra! crushing forts and slaying Dasyus: vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

Sanskit Text: अश्वावन्तं रथिनं वीरवन्तं सहस्रिणं शतिनंवाजमिन्द्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvāvantaṃ rathinaṃ vīravantaṃ sahasriṇaṃ śatinaṃvājamindra |
Translation: 5 Wealthy in heroes and in cars and horses, strength hundredfold and thousandfold, O Indra,

Sanskit Text: भद्रव्रातं विप्रवीरं सवर्षामस्मभ्यंचित्रं वर्षणं रयिं दाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadravrātaṃ vipravīraṃ svarṣāmasmabhyaṃcitraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ ||
Translation: With manly sages, happy troops, Iight-winning: vouchsafe us mighty and resplentdent riches.

Sanskit Text: पर सप्तगुं रतधीतिं सुमेधां बर्हस्पतिं मतिरछाजिगाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra saptaghuṃ ṛtadhītiṃ sumedhāṃ bṛhaspatiṃ matirachājighāti |
Translation: 6 To Saptagu the sage, the holy-minded, to him, Bṛhaspati, the song approaches,

Sanskit Text: य आङगिरसो नमसोपसद्यो.अस्मभ्यं चित्रंव्र्षणं रयिं दाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya āṅghiraso namasopasadyo.asmabhyaṃ citraṃvṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ ||
Translation: Aṅgiras' Son who must be met with homage: vouchsafe us mighty and reslendent riches.

Sanskit Text: वनीवानो मम दूतास इन्द्रं सतोमाश्चरन्ति सुमतीरियानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanīvāno mama dūtāsa indraṃ stomāścaranti sumatīriyānāḥ |
Translation: 7 My lauds, like envoys, craving loving-kindness, go forth to Indra with their strong entreaty,

Sanskit Text: हर्दिस्प्र्शो मनसा वच्यमाना अस्मभ्यं चित्रंव्र्षणं रयिं दाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hṛdispṛśo manasā vacyamānā asmabhyaṃ citraṃvṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ ||
Translation: Moving his heart and uttered by my spirit: vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

Sanskit Text: यत तवा यामि दद्धि तन न इन्द्र बर्हन्तं कषयमसमंजनानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat tvā yāmi daddhi tan na indra bṛhantaṃ kṣayamasamaṃjanānām |
Translation: 8 Grant us the boon for which I pray, O Indra, a spacious home unmatched among the people.

Sanskit Text: अभि तद दयावाप्र्थिवी गर्णीतामस्मभ्यंचित्रं वर्षणं रयिं दाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tad dyāvāpṛthivī ghṛṇītāmasmabhyaṃcitraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ ||
Translation: To this may Heaven and Earth accord approval: vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

Sanskit Text: अहं भुवं वसुनः पूर्व्यस पतिरहं धनानि संजयामि शश्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ bhuvaṃ vasunaḥ pūrvyas patirahaṃ dhanāni saṃjayāmi śaśvataḥ |
Translation: 1. I WAS the first possessor of all precious gear: the wealth of every man I win and gather up.

Sanskit Text: मां हवन्ते पितरं न जन्तवो.अहन्दाशुषे वि भजामि भोजनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: māṃ havante pitaraṃ na jantavo.ahandāśuṣe vi bhajāmi bhojanam ||
Translation: On me as on a Father living creatures call; I deal enjoyment to tho. man who offers gifts.

Sanskit Text: अहमिन्द्रो रोधो वक्षो अथर्वणस्त्रिताय गा अजनयमहेरधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahamindro rodho vakṣo atharvaṇastritāya ghā ajanayamaheradhi |
Translation: 2 I, Indra, am Atharvan's stay and firm support: I brought forth kine to Trita from the Dragon's grasp.

Sanskit Text: अहं दस्युभ्यः परि नर्म्णमा ददे गोत्रा शिक्षन्दधीचे मातरिश्वने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ dasyubhyaḥ pari nṛmṇamā dade ghotrā śikṣandadhīce mātariśvane ||
Translation: I stripped the Dasyus of their manly might, and gave the cattle-stalls to Matarigvan and Dadhyac.

Sanskit Text: मह्यं तवष्टा वज्रमतक्षदायसं मयि देवासो.अव्र्जन्नपि करतुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahyaṃ tvaṣṭā vajramatakṣadāyasaṃ mayi devāso.avṛjannapi kratum |
Translation: 3 For me hath Tvaṣṭar forged the iron thunderbolt: in me the Gods have centred intellectual power.

Sanskit Text: ममानीकं सूर्यस्येव दुष्टरं मामार्यन्तिक्र्तेन कर्त्वेन च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mamānīkaṃ sūryasyeva duṣṭaraṃ māmāryantikṛtena kartvena ca ||
Translation: My sheen is like the Sun's insufferably bright: men honour me as Lord for past and future deeds.

Sanskit Text: अहमेतं गव्ययमश्व्यं पशुं पुरीषिणं सायकेनाहिरण्ययम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahametaṃ ghavyayamaśvyaṃ paśuṃ purīṣiṇaṃ sāyakenāhiraṇyayam |
Translation: 4 I won myself these herdi of cattle, steeds and kine, and gold in ample store, with my destructive bolt.

Sanskit Text: पुरू सहस्रा नि शिशामि दाशुषे यन मासोमास उक्थिनो अमन्दिषुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purū sahasrā ni śiśāmi dāśuṣe yan māsomāsa ukthino amandiṣuḥ ||
Translation: I give full many a thousand to the worshipper, what time the Somas and the lauds have made me glad.

Sanskit Text: अहमिन्द्रो न परा जिग्य इद धनं न मर्त्यवे.अव तस्थेकदा चन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahamindro na parā jighya id dhanaṃ na mṛtyave.ava tasthekadā cana |
Translation: 5 Indra am I none ever wins my wealth from me never at any time am I a thrall to death.

Sanskit Text: सोममिन मा सुन्वन्तो याचता वसु न मेपूरवः सख्ये रिषाथन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: somamin mā sunvanto yācatā vasu na mepūravaḥ sakhye riṣāthana ||
Translation: Pressing the Soma, ask riches from me alone: ye, Pūrus, in my friendship shall not suffer harm.

Sanskit Text: अहमेताञ्छाश्वसतो दवा-दवेन्द्रं ये वज्रं युधयेऽकर्ण्वत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahametāñchāśvasato dvā-dvendraṃ ye vajraṃ yudhaye'kṛṇvata |
Translation: 6 These, breathing loud in fury, two and two, who caused Indra to bring his bolt of thunder to the fray,

Sanskit Text: आह्वयमानानव हन्मनाहनं दर्ळा वदन्ननमस्युर्नमस्विनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āhvayamānānava hanmanāhanaṃ dṛḷā vadannanamasyurnamasvinaḥ ||
Translation: The challengers, I struck with deadly weapon down: firm stand what words the God speaks to his worshippers.

Sanskit Text: अभीदमेकमेको अस्मि निष्षाळ अभी दवा किमु तरयःकरन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhīdamekameko asmi niṣṣāḷ abhī dvā kimu trayaḥkaranti |
Translation: This One by stronger might I conquered singly; yea, also two: shall three prevail against me?

Sanskit Text: खले न पर्षान परति हन्मि भूरि किं मा निन्दन्तिशत्रवो.अनिन्द्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: khale na parṣān prati hanmi bhūri kiṃ mā nindantiśatravo.anindrāḥ ||
Translation: Like many sheaves upon the floor I thrash them. How can my foes, the Indraless, revile me?

Sanskit Text: अहं गुङगुभ्यो अतिथिग्वमिष्करमिषं न वर्त्रतुरंविक्षु धारयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ ghuṅghubhyo atithighvamiṣkaramiṣaṃ na vṛtraturaṃvikṣu dhārayam |
Translation: 8 Against the Gungus I made Atithigva strong, and kept him mid the folk like Vṛtra-conquering strength,

Sanskit Text: यत पर्णयघ्न उत वा करञ्जहे पराहम्महे वर्त्रहत्ये अशुश्रवि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat parṇayaghna uta vā karañjahe prāhammahe vṛtrahatye aśuśravi ||
Translation: When I won glory in the great foe-slaying fight, in battle where Karanja fell, and Parṇaya.

Sanskit Text: पर मे नमी साप्य इषे भुजे भूद गवामेषे सख्याक्र्णुत दविता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra me namī sāpya iṣe bhuje bhūd ghavāmeṣe sakhyākṛṇuta dvitā |
Translation: 9 With food for mine enjoyment Sapya Nami came: he joined me as a friend of old in search of kine.

Sanskit Text: दिद्युं यदस्य समिथेषु मंहयमादिदेनं शंस्यमुक्थ्यं करम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: didyuṃ yadasya samitheṣu maṃhayamādidenaṃ śaṃsyamukthyaṃ karam ||
Translation: As I bestowed on him an arrow for the fight I made him worthy of the song apd hymn of praise.

Sanskit Text: पर नेमस्मिन दद्र्शे सोमो अन्तर्गोपा नेममाविरस्थाक्र्णोति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra nemasmin dadṛśe somo antarghopā nemamāvirasthākṛṇoti |
Translation: 10 One of the two hath Soma, seen within it; the Herdsman with the bone shows forth the other.

Sanskit Text: स तिग्मश्र्ङगं वर्षभं युयुत्सन दरुहस्तस्थौबहुले बद्धो अन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tighmaśṛṅghaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ yuyutsan druhastasthaubahule baddho antaḥ ||
Translation: He, fain to fight the Bull whose horns were sharpened, stood fettered in the demon's ample region.

Sanskit Text: आदित्यानां वसूनां रुद्रियाणां देवो देवानां नमिनामि धाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityānāṃ vasūnāṃ rudriyāṇāṃ devo devānāṃ namināmi dhāma |
Translation: 11 I, as a God, ne’er violate the statutes of Gods, of Vasus, Rudriyas, Ādityas.

Sanskit Text: ते मा भद्राय शवसे ततक्षुरपराजितमस्त्र्तमषाळम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te mā bhadrāya śavase tatakṣuraparājitamastṛtamaṣāḷam ||
Translation: These Gods have formed me for auspicious vigour, unconquered and invincible for ever.

Sanskit Text: अहं दां गर्णते पूर्व्यं वस्वहं बरह्म कर्णवं मह्यंवर्धनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ dāṃ ghṛṇate pūrvyaṃ vasvahaṃ brahma kṛṇavaṃ mahyaṃvardhanam |
Translation: 1. I HAVE enriched the singer with surpassing wealth; I have allowed the holy hymn to strengthen me.

Sanskit Text: अहं भुवं यजमानस्य चोदितायज्वनः साक्षिविश्वस्मिन भरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ bhuvaṃ yajamānasya coditāyajvanaḥ sākṣiviśvasmin bhare ||
Translation: I, furtherer of him who offers sacrifice, have conquered in each fight the men who worship not.

Sanskit Text: मां धुरिन्द्रं नाम देवता दिवश्च गमश्चापां चजन्तवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: māṃ dhurindraṃ nāma devatā divaśca ghmaścāpāṃ cajantavaḥ |
Translation: 2 The People of the heavens, the waters, and the earth have stablished me among the Gods with Indra's name.

Sanskit Text: अहं हरी वर्षणा विव्रता रघू अहंवज्रं शवसे धर्ष्ण्वा ददे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ harī vṛṣaṇā vivratā raghū ahaṃvajraṃ śavase dhṛṣṇvā dade ||
Translation: I took unto myself the two swift vigorous Bays that speed on divers paths, and the fierce bolt for strength.

Sanskit Text: अहमत्कं कवये शिश्नथं हथैरहं कुत्समावमाभिरूतिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahamatkaṃ kavaye śiśnathaṃ hathairahaṃ kutsamāvamābhirūtibhiḥ |
Translation: 3 With deadly blows I smote Atka for Kavi's sake; I guarded Kutsa well with these saving helps.

Sanskit Text: अहं शुष्णस्य शनथिता वधर्यमंन यो रर आर्यं नाम दस्यवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ śuṣṇasya śnathitā vadharyamaṃna yo rara āryaṃ nāma dasyave ||
Translation: As Śuṣṇa's slayer I brandished the dart of death: I gave not up the Āryan name to Dasyu foes.

Sanskit Text: अहं पितेव वेतसून्रभिष्टये तुग्रं कुत्साय समदिभंच रन्धयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ piteva vetasūnrabhiṣṭaye tughraṃ kutsāya smadibhaṃca randhayam |
Translation: 4 Smadibha, Tugra, and the Vetasus I gave as prey to Kutsa, father-like, to succour him.

Sanskit Text: अहं भुवं यजमानस्य राजनि पर यद भरेतुजये न परियाध्र्षे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ bhuvaṃ yajamānasya rājani pra yad bharetujaye na priyādhṛṣe ||
Translation: I was a worthy King to rule the worshipper, when I gave Tuji dear inviolable gifts.

Sanskit Text: अहं रन्धयं मर्गयं शरुतर्वणे यन माजिहीत वयुनाचनानुषक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ randhayaṃ mṛghayaṃ śrutarvaṇe yan mājihīta vayunācanānuṣak |
Translation: 5 I gave up Mṛgaya to Srutarvan as his prey because he ever followed me and kept my laws.

Sanskit Text: अहं वेशं नम्रमायवे.अकरमहंसव्याय पड्ग्र्भिमरन्धयम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ veśaṃ namramāyave.akaramahaṃsavyāya paḍghṛbhimarandhayam ||
Translation: For Āyu's sake I caused Veta to bend and bow, and into Savya's hand delivered Padgrbhi.

Sanskit Text: अहं स यो नववास्त्वं बर्हद्रथं सं वर्त्रेव दासंव्र्त्रहारुजम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ sa yo navavāstvaṃ bṛhadrathaṃ saṃ vṛtreva dāsaṃvṛtrahārujam |
Translation: 6 1, I crushed Navavāstva of the lofty car, the Dāsa, as the Vṛtra-slayer kills the fiends;

Sanskit Text: यद वर्धयन्तं परथयन्तमानुषग दूरेपारे रजसो रोचनाकरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vardhayantaṃ prathayantamānuṣagh dūrepāre rajaso rocanākaram ||
Translation: When straightway on the region's farthest edge I brought the God who makes the lights to broaden and increase.

Sanskit Text: अहं सूर्यस्य परि याम्याशुभिः परैतशेभिर्वहमानोजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ sūryasya pari yāmyāśubhiḥ praitaśebhirvahamānaojasā |
Translation: 7 I travel round about borne onward in my might by the fleet-footed dappled Horses of the Sun.

Sanskit Text: यन मा सावो मनुष आह निर्णिज रधक कर्षेदासं कर्त्व्यं हथैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yan mā sāvo manuṣa āha nirṇija ṛdhak kṛṣedāsaṃ kṛtvyaṃ hathaiḥ ||
Translation: When man's libation calls me to the robe of state I soon repel the powerful Dasyu with my blows.

Sanskit Text: अहं सप्तहा नहुषो नहुष्टरः पराश्राव यं शवसातुर्वशं यदुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ saptahā nahuṣo nahuṣṭaraḥ prāśrāva yaṃ śavasāturvaśaṃ yadum |
Translation: 8 Stronger am I than Nabus, I who slew the seven: I glorified with might Yadu and Turvaga.

Sanskit Text: अहं नयन्यं सहसा सहस करं नवव्राधतो नवतिं च वक्षयम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ nyanyaṃ sahasā sahas karaṃ navavrādhato navatiṃ ca vakṣayam ||
Translation: I brought another low, with strength I bent his strength: I let the mighty nine-and-ninety wax in power.

Sanskit Text: अहं सप्त सरवतो धारयं वर्षा दरवित्न्वः पर्थिव्यांसीरा अधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ sapta sravato dhārayaṃ vṛṣā dravitnvaḥ pṛthivyāṃsīrā adhi |
Translation: 9 Bull over all the streams that flow along the earth, I took the Seven Rivers as mine own domain.

Sanskit Text: अहमर्णांसि वि तिरामि सुक्रतुर्युधा विदम्मनवे गातुमिष्टये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahamarṇāṃsi vi tirāmi sukraturyudhā vidammanave ghātumiṣṭaye ||
Translation: I, gifted with great wisdom, spread the floods abroad: by war I found for man the way to high success.

Sanskit Text: अहं तदासु धारयं यदासु न देवश्चनत्वष्टाधारयद रुशत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ tadāsu dhārayaṃ yadāsu na devaścanatvaṣṭādhārayad ruśat |
Translation: 10 I set within these cows the white milk which no God, not even Tvaṣṭar's self, had there deposited,—

Sanskit Text: सपार्हं गवामूधस्सुवक्षणास्वा मधोर्मधु शवात्र्यं सोममाशिरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: spārhaṃ ghavāmūdhassuvakṣaṇāsvā madhormadhu śvātryaṃ somamāśiram ||
Translation: Much-longed-for, in the breasts, the udders of the kine, the savoury sweets of meath, the milk and Soma juice.

Sanskit Text: एवा देवानिन्द्रो विव्ये नॄन पर चयौत्नेन मघवासत्यराधाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā devānindro vivye nṝn pra cyautnena maghavāsatyarādhāḥ |
Translation: 11 Even thus hath Indra Maghavan, truly bounteous, sped Gods and men with mighty operation.

Sanskit Text: विश्वेत ता ते हरिवः शचीवो.अभितुरासः सवयशो गर्णन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvet tā te harivaḥ śacīvo.abhiturāsaḥ svayaśo ghṛṇanti ||
Translation: The pious glorify all these thine exploits, Lord of Bay Coursers, Strong, and Selfresplendent.

Sanskit Text: पर वो महे मन्दमानायान्धसो.अर्चा विश्वानरायविश्वाभुवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vo mahe mandamānāyāndhaso.arcā viśvānarāyaviśvābhuve |
Translation: 1. I LAUD your Mighty One who joyeth in the juice, him who is shared by all men, who created all;

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य यस्य सुमखं सहो महि शरवोन्र्म्णं च रोदसी सपर्यतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya yasya sumakhaṃ saho mahi śravonṛmṇaṃ ca rodasī saparyataḥ ||
Translation: Indra, whose conquering strength is powerful in war, whose fame and manly vigour Heaven and Earth revere.

Sanskit Text: सो चिन नु सख्या नर्य इन सतुतश्चर्क्र्त्य इन्द्रो मावतेनरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: so cin nu sakhyā narya ina stutaścarkṛtya indro māvatenare |
Translation: 2 He with his friend is active, lauded, good to man, Indra who must be glorified by one like me.

Sanskit Text: विश्वासु धूर्षु वाजक्र्त्येषु सत्पते वर्त्रे वाप्स्वभि शूर मन्दसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāsu dhūrṣu vājakṛtyeṣu satpate vṛtre vāpsvabhi śūra mandase ||
Translation: Hero, Lord of the brave, all cars are thy delight, warring with Vṛtra, or for waters, or for spoil.

Sanskit Text: के ते नर इन्द्र ये त इषे ये ते सुम्नं सधन्यमियक्षान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ke te nara indra ye ta iṣe ye te sumnaṃ sadhanyamiyakṣān |
Translation: 3 Who are the men whom thou wilt further, Indra, who strive to win thy bliss allied with riches?

Sanskit Text: के ते वाजायासुर्याय हिन्विरे के अप्सु सवासूर्वरासुपौंस्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ke te vājāyāsuryāya hinvire ke apsu svāsūrvarāsupauṃsye ||
Translation: Who urged thee forward to exert thy power divine, to valour, in the war for waters on their fields?

Sanskit Text: भुवस्त्वमिन्द्र बरह्मणा महान भुवो विश्वेषु सवनेषुयज्ञियः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhuvastvamindra brahmaṇā mahān bhuvo viśveṣu savaneṣuyajñiyaḥ |
Translation: 4 Thou, Indra, through the holy prayer art mighty, worthy of sacrifice at all libations.

Sanskit Text: भुवो नॄंश्च्यौत्नो विश्वस्मिन भरेज्येष्ठश्च मन्त्रो विश्वचर्षणे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhuvo nṝṃścyautno viśvasmin bharejyeṣṭhaśca mantro viśvacarṣaṇe ||
Translation: In every fight thou castest heroes on the ground: thou art the noblest song, O Lord of all the folk.

Sanskit Text: अवा नु कं जयायान यज्ञवनसो महीं त ओमात्रांक्र्ष्टयो विदुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avā nu kaṃ jyāyān yajñavanaso mahīṃ ta omātrāṃkṛṣṭayo viduḥ |
Translation: 5 Help now, as Highest, those who toil at sacrifice: well do the people know thy great protecting might.

Sanskit Text: असो नु कमजरो वर्धाश्च विश्वेदेतासवना तूतुमा कर्षे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aso nu kamajaro vardhāśca viśvedetāsavanā tūtumā kṛṣe ||
Translation: Thou shalt be Everlasing, Giver of success yea, on all these libations thou bestowest strength.

Sanskit Text: एता विश्वा सवना तूतुमाक्र्षे सवयं सूनो सहसो यानिदधिषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etā viśvā savanā tūtumākṛṣe svayaṃ sūno sahaso yānidadhiṣe |
Translation: 6 All these libations thou makest effectual, of which thou art thyself supporter, Son of Power.

Sanskit Text: वराय ते पात्रं धर्मणे तना यज्ञो मन्त्रोब्रह्मोद्यतं वचः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: varāya te pātraṃ dharmaṇe tanā yajño mantrobrahmodyataṃ vacaḥ ||
Translation: Therefore thy vessel is to be esteemed the best, sacrifice, holy text, prayer, and exalted speech.

Sanskit Text: ये ते विप्र बरह्मक्र्तः सुते सचा वसूनां च वसुनश्चदावने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye te vipra brahmakṛtaḥ sute sacā vasūnāṃ ca vasunaścadāvane |
Translation: 7 They who with flowing Soma pray to thee, O Sage, to pour on them thy gifts of opulence and wealth,

Sanskit Text: पर ते सुम्नस्य मनसा पथा भुवन मदे सुतस्यसोम्यस्यान्धसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te sumnasya manasā pathā bhuvan made sutasyasomyasyāndhasaḥ ||
Translation: May they come forward, through their spirit, on the path of bliss, in the wild joy of Soma juice effused.

Sanskit Text: महत तदुल्बं सथविरं तदासीद येनाविष्टितःप्रविवेशिथापः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahat tadulbaṃ sthaviraṃ tadāsīd yenāviṣṭitaḥpraviveśithāpaḥ |
Translation: 1. LARGE was that covering, and firm of texture, folded wherein thou enteredst the waters.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा अपश्यद बहुधा ते अग्ने जातवेदस्तन्वो देव एकः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā apaśyad bahudhā te aghne jātavedastanvo deva ekaḥ ||
Translation: One Deity alone, O Jātavedas Agni, saw all thy forms in sundry places.

Sanskit Text: को मा ददर्श कतमः स देवो यो मे तन्वो बहुधापर्यपश्यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko mā dadarśa katamaḥ sa devo yo me tanvo bahudhāparyapaśyat |
Translation: 2 What God hath seen me? Who of all their number clearly beheld my forms in many places?

Sanskit Text: कवाह मित्रावरुणा कषियन्त्यग्नेर्विस्वाःसमिधो देवयानीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kvāha mitrāvaruṇā kṣiyantyaghnervisvāḥsamidho devayānīḥ ||
Translation: Where lie, then, all the sacred logs of Agni that lead him God-ward, Varuṇa and Mitra?

Sanskit Text: ऐछाम तवा बहुधा जातवेदः परविष्टमग्ने अप्स्वोषधीषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aichāma tvā bahudhā jātavedaḥ praviṣṭamaghne apsvoṣadhīṣu |
Translation: 3 In many places, Agni Jātavedas, we sought thee hidden in the plants and waters.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा यमो अचिकेच्चित्रभानो दशान्तरुष्यादतिरोचमानम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā yamo acikeccitrabhāno daśāntaruṣyādatirocamānam ||
Translation: Then Yama marked thee, God of wondrous splendour! effulgent from thy tenfold secret dwelling,

Sanskit Text: होत्रादहं वरुण बिभ्यदायं नेदेव मा युनजन्नत्रदेवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hotrādahaṃ varuṇa bibhyadāyaṃ nedeva mā yunajannatradevāḥ |
Translation: 4 I fled in fear from sacrificial worship, Varuṇa, lest the Gods should thus engage me.

Sanskit Text: तस्य मे तन्वो बहुधा निविष्टा एतमर्थं नचिकेताहमग्निः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya me tanvo bahudhā niviṣṭā etamarthaṃ naciketāhamaghniḥ ||
Translation: Thus were my forms laid down in many places. This, as my goal, I Agni saw before me.

Sanskit Text: एहि मनुर्देवयुर्यज्ञकामो.अरंक्र्त्या तमसि कषेष्यग्ने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ehi manurdevayuryajñakāmo.araṃkṛtyā tamasi kṣeṣyaghne |
Translation: 5 Come; man is pious and would fain do worship, he waits prepared: in gloom thou, Agni, dwellest.

Sanskit Text: सुगान पथः कर्णुहि देवयानान वह हव्यानिसुमनस्यमानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sughān pathaḥ kṛṇuhi devayānān vaha havyānisumanasyamānaḥ ||
Translation: Make pathways leading God-ward clear and easy, and bear oblations with a kindly spirit.

Sanskit Text: अग्नेः पूर्वे भरातरो अर्थमेतं रथीवाध्वानमन्वावरीवुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghneḥ pūrve bhrātaro arthametaṃ rathīvādhvānamanvāvarīvuḥ |
Translation: 6 This goal mine elder brothers erst selected, as he who drives a car the way to travel.

Sanskit Text: तस्माद भिया वरुण दूरमायं गौरो नक्षेप्नोरविजे जयायाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmād bhiyā varuṇa dūramāyaṃ ghauro nakṣepnoravije jyāyāḥ ||
Translation: So,Varuṇa, I fled afar through terror, as flies the wild-bull from an archer's bowstring.

Sanskit Text: कुर्मस्त आयुरजरं यदग्ने यथा युक्तो जातवेदो नरिष्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kurmasta āyurajaraṃ yadaghne yathā yukto jātavedo nariṣyāḥ |
Translation: 7 We give thee life unwasting, Jātavedas, so that, employed, thou never shalt be injured.

Sanskit Text: अथा वहासि सुमनस्यमानो भागं देवेभ्योहविषः सुजात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā vahāsi sumanasyamāno bhāghaṃ devebhyohaviṣaḥ sujāta ||
Translation: So, nobly born! shalt thou with kindly spirit bear to the Gods their share of men's oblations.

Sanskit Text: परयाजान मे अनुयाजांश्च केवलानूर्जस्वन्तं हविषोदत्त भागम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prayājān me anuyājāṃśca kevalānūrjasvantaṃ haviṣodatta bhāgham |
Translation: 8 Grant me the first oblations and the latter, entire, my forceful shares of holy presents,

Sanskit Text: घर्तं चापां पुरुषं चौषधीनामग्नेश्च दीर्घमायुरस्तु देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtaṃ cāpāṃ puruṣaṃ cauṣadhīnāmaghneśca dīrghamāyurastu devāḥ ||
Translation: The soul of plants, the fatness of the waters, and let there be long life, ye Gods, to Agni.

Sanskit Text: तव परयाजा अनुयाजाश्च केवल ऊर्जस्वन्तो हविषः सन्तुभागाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava prayājā anuyājāśca kevala ūrjasvanto haviṣaḥ santubhāghāḥ |
Translation: 9 Thine be the first oblations and the latter, entire, thy forceful shares of holy presents.

Sanskit Text: तवाग्ने यज्ञो.अयमस्तु सर्वस्तुभ्यं नमन्ताम्प्रदिशश्चतस्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tavāghne yajño.ayamastu sarvastubhyaṃ namantāmpradiśaścatasraḥ ||
Translation: Let all this sacrifice be thine, O Agni, and let the world's four regions how before thee.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवाः शास्तन मा यथेह होता वर्तो मनवै यन्निषद्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devāḥ śāstana mā yatheha hotā vṛto manavai yanniṣadya |
Translation: 1. INSTRUCT me, all ye Gods, how I, elected your Priest, must seat me here, and how address you.

Sanskit Text: पर मे बरूत भागधेयं यथा वो येन पथाहव्यमा वो वहानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra me brūta bhāghadheyaṃ yathā vo yena pathāhavyamā vo vahāni ||
Translation: Instruct me how to deal to each his portion, and by what ' path to bring you man's oblation.

Sanskit Text: अहं होता नयसीदं यजीयान विश्वे देवा मरुतो माजुनन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ hotā nyasīdaṃ yajīyān viśve devā maruto mājunanti |
Translation: 2 I sit as Priest most skilled in sacrificing: the Maruts and all Deities impel me.

Sanskit Text: अहर-अहरश्विनाध्वर्यवं वां बरह्मा समिद भवतिसाहुतिर्वाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahar-aharaśvinādhvaryavaṃ vāṃ brahmā samid bhavatisāhutirvām ||
Translation: Aśvins, each day yours is the Adhvaryu's duty: Brahman and wood are here: ’tis yours to offer.

Sanskit Text: अयं यो होता किरु स यमस्य कमप्यूहे यत समञ्जन्तिदेवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ yo hotā kiru sa yamasya kamapyūhe yat samañjantidevāḥ |
Translation: 3 Who is the Priest? Is he the Priest of Yama? On whom is thrust this God-appointed honour?

Sanskit Text: अहर-अहर्जायते मासि-मास्यथा देवा दधिरेहव्यवाहम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahar-aharjāyate māsi-māsyathā devā dadhirehavyavāham ||
Translation: He springs to life each month, each day that passes; so Gods have made him their oblation-bearer.

Sanskit Text: मां देवा दधिरे हव्यवाहमपम्लुक्तं बहु कर्छ्राचरन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: māṃ devā dadhire havyavāhamapamluktaṃ bahu kṛchrācarantam |
Translation: 4 The Gods have made me bearer of oblations, who slipped away and passed through many troubles.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्विद्वान यज्ञं नः कल्पयाति पञ्चयामन्त्रिव्र्तं सप्ततन्तुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirvidvān yajñaṃ naḥ kalpayāti pañcayāmantrivṛtaṃ saptatantum ||
Translation: Wise Agni shall ordain for us the worship, whether five-wayed, threefold, or seven-threaded.

Sanskit Text: आ वो यक्ष्यम्र्तत्वं सुवीरं यथा वो देवा वरिवःकराणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vo yakṣyamṛtatvaṃ suvīraṃ yathā vo devā varivaḥkarāṇi |
Translation: 5 So will I win you strength and life for ever. O Gods, that I may give you room and freedom.

Sanskit Text: आ बाह्वोर्वज्रमिन्द्रस्य धेयामथेमाविश्वाः पर्तना जयाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā bāhvorvajramindrasya dheyāmathemāviśvāḥ pṛtanā jayāti ||
Translation: To Indra's arms would I consign the thunder; in all these battles shall he then be victor.

Sanskit Text: तरीणि शता तरी सहस्राण्यग्निं तरिंशच्च देवा नवचासपर्यन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trīṇi śatā trī sahasrāṇyaghniṃ triṃśacca devā navacāsaparyan |
Translation: 6 The Deities three hundred and thirty-nine, have served and honoured Agni,

Sanskit Text: औक्षन घर्तैरस्त्र्णन बर्हिरस्मा आदिद्धोतारं नयसादयन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aukṣan ghṛtairastṛṇan barhirasmā ādiddhotāraṃ nyasādayanta ||
Translation: Strewn sacred grass, anointed him with butter, and seated him as Priest, the Gods’ Invoker.

Sanskit Text: तां सु ते कीर्तिं मघवन महित्वा यत तवा भीते रोदसीह्वयेताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāṃ su te kīrtiṃ maghavan mahitvā yat tvā bhīte rodasīahvayetām |
Translation: 1. I SING thy fame that, Maghavan, through thy Greatness the heavens and earth invoked thee in their terror,

Sanskit Text: परावो देवानातिरो दासमोजः परजायैत्वस्यै यदशिक्ष इन्द्र ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāvo devānātiro dāsamojaḥ prajāyaitvasyai yadaśikṣa indra ||
Translation: Thou, aiding Gods, didst quell the power of Dāsas, what time thou holpest many a race, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: यदचरस्तन्वा वाव्र्धानो बलानीन्द्र परब्रुवाणो जनेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadacarastanvā vāvṛdhāno balānīndra prabruvāṇo janeṣu |
Translation: 2 When thou wast roaming, waxen strong in body, telling thy might, Indra, among the people,

Sanskit Text: मायेत सा ते यानि युद्धान्याहुर्नाद्य शत्रुं ननुपुरा विवित्से ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: māyet sā te yāni yuddhānyāhurnādya śatruṃ nanupurā vivitse ||
Translation: All that men called thy battles was illusion: no foe hast thou to-day, nor erst hast found one.

Sanskit Text: क उ नु ते महिमनः समस्यास्मत पूर्व रषयो.अन्तमापुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ka u nu te mahimanaḥ samasyāsmat pūrva ṛṣayo.antamāpuḥ |
Translation: 3 Who are the Ṛṣis, then, who comprehended before our time the bounds of all thy greatness?

Sanskit Text: यन मातरं च पितरं च साकमजनयथास्तन्वःस्वायाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yan mātaraṃ ca pitaraṃ ca sākamajanayathāstanvaḥsvāyāḥ ||
Translation: For from thy body thou hast generated at the same time the Mother and the Father.

Sanskit Text: चत्वारि ते असुर्याणि नामादाभ्यानि महिषस्य सन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: catvāri te asuryāṇi nāmādābhyāni mahiṣasya santi |
Translation: 4 Thou, Mighty Steer, hast four supremest natures, Asura natures that may ne’er be injured.

Sanskit Text: तवमङग तानि विश्वानि वित्से येभिः कर्माणि मघवञ्चकर्थ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamaṅgha tāni viśvāni vitse yebhiḥ karmāṇi maghavañcakartha ||
Translation: All these, O Maghavan, thou surely knowest, wherewith thou hast performed thy great achievements.

Sanskit Text: तवं विश्वा दधिषे केवलानि यान्याविर्या च गुहावसूनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ viśvā dadhiṣe kevalāni yānyāviryā ca ghuhāvasūni |
Translation: 5 Thou hast all treasures in thy sole possession, treasures made manifest and treasures hidden.

Sanskit Text: काममिन मे मघवन मा वि तारीस्त्वमाज्ञातात्वमिन्द्रासि दाता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kāmamin me maghavan mā vi tārīstvamājñātātvamindrāsi dātā ||
Translation: Defer not thou, O Maghavan, my longing: thou, art Director, Indra, thou art Giver.

Sanskit Text: यो अदधाज्ज्योतिषि जयोतिरन्तर्यो अस्र्जन मधुना सम्मधूनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo adadhājjyotiṣi jyotirantaryo asṛjan madhunā sammadhūni |
Translation: 6 To him who set the light in things of splendour, and with all sweetness blent essential sweetness,

Sanskit Text: अध परियं शूषमिन्द्राय मन्म बरह्मक्र्तोब्र्हदुक्थादवाचि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha priyaṃ śūṣamindrāya manma brahmakṛtobṛhadukthādavāci ||
Translation: To Indra hath this welcome hymn that strengthens been uttered by the votary Bṛhaduktha.

Sanskit Text: दूरे तन नाम गुह्यं पराचैर्यत तवा भीते अह्वयेतांवयोधै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūre tan nāma ghuhyaṃ parācairyat tvā bhīte ahvayetāṃvayodhai |
Translation: 1. FAR is that secret name by which, in terror, the worlds invoked thee and thou gavest vigour

Sanskit Text: उदस्तभ्नाः पर्थिवीं दयामभीके भरातुःपुत्रान मघवन तित्विषाणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: udastabhnāḥ pṛthivīṃ dyāmabhīke bhrātuḥputrān maghavan titviṣāṇaḥ ||
Translation: The earth and heaven thou settest near each other, and Maghavan, madest bright thy Brother's Children.

Sanskit Text: महत तन नाम गुह्यं पुरुस्प्र्ग येन भूतं जनयो येनभव्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahat tan nāma ghuhyaṃ puruspṛgh yena bhūtaṃ janayo yenabhavyam |
Translation: 2 Great is that secret name and far-extending, whereby thou madest all that is and shall be.

Sanskit Text: परत्नं जातं जयोतिर्यदस्य परियं परियाः समविशन्त पञ्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratnaṃ jātaṃ jyotiryadasya priyaṃ priyāḥ samaviśanta pañca ||
Translation: The Five Tribes whom he loveth well have entered the light he loveth that was made aforetime.

Sanskit Text: आ रोदसी अप्र्णादोत मध्यं पञ्च देवान रतुशः सप्त सप्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā rodasī apṛṇādota madhyaṃ pañca devān ṛtuśaḥ sapta sapta |
Translation: 3 He filled the heaven and earth and all between them, Gods five times sevenfold in their proper seasons.

Sanskit Text: चतुस्त्रिंशता पुरुधा वि चष्टे सरूपेण जयोतिषाविव्रतेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: catustriṃśatā purudhā vi caṣṭe sarūpeṇa jyotiṣāvivratena ||
Translation: With four-and-thirty lights he looks around him, lights of one colour though their ways are divers.

Sanskit Text: यदुष औछः परथमा विभानामजनयो येन पुष्टस्यपुष्टम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaduṣa auchaḥ prathamā vibhānāmajanayo yena puṣṭasyapuṣṭam |
Translation: 4 As first among the lights, O Dawn, thou shonest, whereby thou broughtest forth the Stay of Increase,

Sanskit Text: यत ते जामित्वमवरं परस्या महन महत्यासुरत्वमेकम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te jāmitvamavaraṃ parasyā mahan mahatyāasuratvamekam ||
Translation: Great art thou, matchless is thine Asura nature, who, high above, art kin to those beneath thee.

Sanskit Text: विधुं दद्राणं समने बहूनां युवानं सन्तं पलितोजगार |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidhuṃ dadrāṇaṃ samane bahūnāṃ yuvānaṃ santaṃ palitojaghāra |
Translation: 5 The old hath waked the young Moon from his slumber who runs his circling course with many round him.

Sanskit Text: देवस्य पश्य काव्यं महित्वाद्या ममार स हयःसमान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devasya paśya kāvyaṃ mahitvādyā mamāra sa hyaḥsamāna ||
Translation: Behold the Gods’ high wisdom in its greatness: he who died yesterday to-day is living.

Sanskit Text: शाक्मना शाको अरुणः सुपर्ण आ यो महः शूरःसनादनीळः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śākmanā śāko aruṇaḥ suparṇa ā yo mahaḥ śūraḥsanādanīḷaḥ |
Translation: 6 Strong is the Red Bird in his strength, great Hero, who from of old hath had no nest to dwell in.

Sanskit Text: यच्चिकेत सत्यमित तन न मोघं वसुस्पार्हमुत जेतोत दाता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yacciketa satyamit tan na moghaṃ vasuspārhamuta jetota dātā ||
Translation: That which he knows is truth and never idle: he wins and gives the wealth desired of many.

Sanskit Text: ऐभिर्ददे वर्ष्ण्या पौंस्यानि येभिरौक्षद वर्त्रहत्यायवज्री |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aibhirdade vṛṣṇyā pauṃsyāni yebhiraukṣad vṛtrahatyāyavajrī |
Translation: 7 Through these the Thunderer gained strong manly vigour, through whom he waxed in power to smite down Vṛtra,—

Sanskit Text: ये कर्मणः करियमाणस्य मह्न रतेकर्ममुदजायन्त देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye karmaṇaḥ kriyamāṇasya mahna ṛtekarmamudajāyanta devāḥ ||
Translation: Who through the might of Indra's operation came forth as Gods in course of Law and Order.

Sanskit Text: युजा कर्माणि जनयन विश्वौजा अशस्तिथा विश्वमनास्तुराषाट |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yujā karmāṇi janayan viśvaujā aśastithā viśvamanāsturāṣāṭ |
Translation: 8 All-strong, performing works with his companion, All-marking, rapid Victor, Curse-averter,

Sanskit Text: पीत्वी सोमस्य दिव आ वर्धानः शूरो निर्युधाधमद दस्यून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pītvī somasya diva ā vṛdhānaḥ śūro niryudhādhamad dasyūn ||
Translation: The Hero, waxing, after draughts of Soma, blew far from heaven the Dasyus with his weapon.

Sanskit Text: इदं त एकं पर ऊ त एकं तर्तीयेन जयोतिषा संविशस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ ta ekaṃ para ū ta ekaṃ tṛtīyena jyotiṣā saṃviśasva |
Translation: 1. HERE is one light for thee, another yonder: enter the third and he therewith united.

Sanskit Text: संवेशने तन्वश्चारुरेधि परियो देवानाम्परमे जनित्रे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃveśane tanvaścāruredhi priyo devānāmparame janitre ||
Translation: Uniting with a body be thou welcome, dear to the Gods in their sublimest birthplace.

Sanskit Text: तनूष टे वाजिन तन्वं नयन्ती वाममस्मभ्यं धातुशर्म तुभ्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tanūṣ ṭe vājin tanvaṃ nayantī vāmamasmabhyaṃ dhātuśarma tubhyam |
Translation: 2 Bearing thy body, Vajin, may thy body afford us blessing and thyself protection.

Sanskit Text: अह्रुतो महो धरुणाय देवान दिवीवज्योतिः सवमा मिमीयाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahruto maho dharuṇāya devān divīvajyotiḥ svamā mimīyāḥ ||
Translation: Unswerving, stablish as it were in heaven thine own light as the mighty God's supporter.

Sanskit Text: वाज्यसि वाजिनेना सुवेनीः सुवित सतोमं सुवितो दिवंगाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājyasi vājinenā suvenīḥ suvita stomaṃ suvito divaṃghāḥ |
Translation: 3 Strong Steed art thou: go to the yearning Maidens with vigour, happily go to heaven and praises:

Sanskit Text: सुवितो धर्म परथमानु सत्या सुवितो देवान सुवितोऽनु पत्म ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvito dharma prathamānu satyā suvito devān suvito'nu patma ||
Translation: Fly happily to the Gods with easy passage, according to the first and faithful statutes.

Sanskit Text: महिम्न एषां पितरश्चनेशिरे देवा देवेष्वदधुरपिक्रतुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahimna eṣāṃ pitaraścaneśire devā deveṣvadadhurapikratum |
Translation: 4 Part of their grandeur have the Fathers also gained: the Gods have seated mental power in them as Gods.

Sanskit Text: समविव्यचुरुत यान्यत्विषुरैषां तनूषु निविविशुः पुनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samavivyacuruta yānyatviṣuraiṣāṃ tanūṣu niviviśuḥ punaḥ ||
Translation: They have embraced within themselves all energies, which, issuing forth, again into their bodies pass.

Sanskit Text: सहोभिर्विश्वं परि चक्रमू रजः पूर्वा धामान्यमितामिमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahobhirviśvaṃ pari cakramū rajaḥ pūrvā dhāmānyamitāmimānāḥ |
Translation: 5 They strode through all the region with victorious might, establishing the old immeasurable laws.

Sanskit Text: तनूषु विश्वा भुवना नि येमिरे परासारयन्तपुरुध परजा अनु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tanūṣu viśvā bhuvanā ni yemire prāsārayantapurudha prajā anu ||
Translation: They compassed in their bodies all existing things, and streamed forth offipring in many successive forms.

Sanskit Text: दविधा सूनवो.असुरं सवर्विदमास्थापयन्त तर्तीयेनकर्मणा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvidhā sūnavo.asuraṃ svarvidamāsthāpayanta tṛtīyenakarmaṇā |
Translation: 6 In two ways have the sons established in his place the Asura who finds the light, by the third act,

Sanskit Text: सवां परजां पितरः पित्र्यं सह आवरेष्वदधुस्तन्तुमाततम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāṃ prajāṃ pitaraḥ pitryaṃ saha āvareṣvadadhustantumātatam ||
Translation: As fathers, they have set their heritage on earth, their offspring, as a thread continuously spun out.

Sanskit Text: नावा न कषोदः परदिशः पर्थिव्याः सवस्तिभिरतिदुर्गाणि विश्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāvā na kṣodaḥ pradiśaḥ pṛthivyāḥ svastibhiratidurghāṇi viśvā |
Translation: 7 As in a ship through billows, so through regions of air, with blessings, through toils and troubles

Sanskit Text: सवां परजां बर्हदुक्थो महित्वावरेष्वदधादा परेषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svāṃ prajāṃ bṛhaduktho mahitvāvareṣvadadhādā pareṣu ||
Translation: Hath Bṛhaduktha brought his seed with glory, and placed it here and in the realms beyond us.

Sanskit Text: मा पर गाम पथो वयं मा यज्ञादिन्द्र सोमिनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā pra ghāma patho vayaṃ mā yajñādindra sominaḥ |
Translation: 1. LET us not, Indra, leave the path, the Soma-presser's sacrifice:

Sanskit Text: मान्त सथुर्नो अरातयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mānta sthurno arātayaḥ ||
Translation: Let no malignity dwell with us.

Sanskit Text: यो यज्ञस्य परसाधनस्तन्तुर्देवेष्वाततः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo yajñasya prasādhanastanturdeveṣvātataḥ |
Translation: 2 May we obtain, completely wrought, the thread spun out to reach the Gods,

Sanskit Text: तमाहुतं नशीमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamāhutaṃ naśīmahi ||
Translation: That perfecteth the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: मनो नवा हुवामहे नाराशंसेन सोमेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mano nvā huvāmahe nārāśaṃsena somena |
Translation: 3 We call the spirit hither with the Soma of our parted sires,

Sanskit Text: पितॄणां चमन्मभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pitṝṇāṃ camanmabhiḥ ||
Translation: Yea, with the Fathers' holy hymns.

Sanskit Text: आ त एतु मनः पुनः करत्वे दक्षाय जीवसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ta etu manaḥ punaḥ kratve dakṣāya jīvase |
Translation: 4 Thy spirit come to thee again for wisdom, energy, and lire,

Sanskit Text: जयोक चसूर्यं दर्शे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyok casūryaṃ dṛśe ||
Translation: That thou mayst long behold the sun!

Sanskit Text: पुनर्नः पितरो मनो ददातु दैव्यो जनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: punarnaḥ pitaro mano dadātu daivyo janaḥ |
Translation: 5 O Fathers, may the Heavenly Folk give us our spirit once again,

Sanskit Text: जीवं वरातंसचेमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jīvaṃ vrātaṃsacemahi ||
Translation: That we may be with those who live.

Sanskit Text: वयं सोम वरते तव मनस्तनूषु बिभ्रतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayaṃ soma vrate tava manastanūṣu bibhrataḥ |
Translation: 6 O Soma with the spirit still within us, blest with progeny,

Sanskit Text: परजावन्तः सचेमहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prajāvantaḥ sacemahi ||
Translation: May we be busied in the law.

Sanskit Text: यत ते यमं वैवस्वतं मनो जगाम दूरकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te yamaṃ vaivasvataṃ mano jaghāma dūrakam |
Translation: 1. THY spirit, that went far away to Yama to Vivasvān's Son,

Sanskit Text: तत त आवर्तयामसीह कषयाय जीवसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tat ta āvartayāmasīha kṣayāya jīvase ||
Translation: We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

Sanskit Text: यत ते दिवं यत पर्थिवीं मनो जगाम दूरकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te divaṃ yat pṛthivīṃ mano jaghāma dūrakam |
Translation: 2 Thy spirit, that went far away, that passed away to earth and heaven,

Sanskrit Transliteration: tat ta ... ||
Translation: We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

Sanskit Text: यत ते भूमिं चतुर्भ्र्ष्टिं मनो जगाम दूरकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te bhūmiṃ caturbhṛṣṭiṃ mano jaghāma dūrakam |
Translation: 3 Thy spirit, that went far away, away to the four-cornered earth,

Sanskrit Transliteration: tat ta... ||
Translation: We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

Sanskit Text: यत ते चतस्रः परदिशो मनो जगाम दूरकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te catasraḥ pradiśo mano jaghāma dūrakam |
Translation: 4 Thy spirit, that went far away to the four quarters of the world,

Sanskrit Transliteration: tat ta ... ||
Translation: We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

Sanskit Text: यत ते समुद्रमर्णवं मनो जगाम दूरकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te samudramarṇavaṃ mano jaghāma dūrakam |
Translation: 5 Thy spirit, that went far away, away unto the billowy sea,

Sanskrit Transliteration: tat ta ... ||
Translation: We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

Sanskit Text: यत ते मरीचीः परवतो मनो जगाम दूरकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te marīcīḥ pravato mano jaghāma dūrakam |
Translation: 6 Thy spirit, that went far away to beams of light that flash and flow,

Sanskrit Transliteration: tat ta ... ||
Translation: We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

Sanskit Text: यत ते अपो यदोषधीर्मनो जगाम दूरकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te apo yadoṣadhīrmano jaghāma dūrakam |
Translation: 7 Thy spirit, that went far away, went to the waters and the plants,

Sanskrit Transliteration: tat ta ... ||
Translation: We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

Sanskit Text: यत ते सूर्यं यदुषसं मनो जगाम दूरकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te sūryaṃ yaduṣasaṃ mano jaghāma dūrakam |
Translation: 8 Thy spirit, that went far away, that visited the Sun and Dawn.

Sanskrit Transliteration: tat ta ... ||
Translation: We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

Sanskit Text: यत ते पर्वतान बर्हतो मनो जगाम दूरकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te parvatān bṛhato mano jaghāma dūrakam |
Translation: 9 Thy spirit, that went far away, away to lofty mountain heights,

Sanskrit Transliteration: tat ta ... ||
Translation: We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

Sanskit Text: यत ते विश्वमिदं जगन मनो जगाम दूरकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te viśvamidaṃ jaghan mano jaghāma dūrakam |
Translation: 10 Thy spirit, that went far away into this All, that lives and moves,

Sanskrit Transliteration: tat ta ... ||
Translation: We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

Sanskit Text: यत ते पराः परावतो मनो जगाम दूरकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te parāḥ parāvato mano jaghāma dūrakam |
Translation: 11 Thy spirit, that went far away to distant realms beyond our ken,

Sanskrit Transliteration: tat ta ... ||
Translation: We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

Sanskit Text: यत ते भूतं च भव्यं च मनो जगाम दूरकम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat te bhūtaṃ ca bhavyaṃ ca mano jaghāma dūrakam |
Translation: 12 Thy spirit, that went far away to all that is and is to be,

Sanskrit Transliteration: tat ta... ||
Translation: We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn heie.

Sanskit Text: पर तार्यायुः परतरं नवीय सथातारेव करतुमतारथस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra tāryāyuḥ prataraṃ navīya sthātāreva kratumatārathasya |
Translation: 1. His life hath been renewed and carried forward as two men, car-borne, by the skilful driver.

Sanskit Text: अध चयवान उत तवीत्यर्थं परातरं सग़्म ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adha cyavāna ut tavītyarthaṃ parātaraṃ sm ||
Translation: One falls, then seeks the goal with quickened vigour. Let Nirrti depart to distant places.

Sanskit Text: सामन नु राये निधिमन नवन्नं करामहे सु पुरुधश्रवांसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sāman nu rāye nidhiman nvannaṃ karāmahe su purudhaśravāṃsi |
Translation: 2 Here is the psalm for wealth, and food, in plenty: let us do many deeds to bring us glory.

Sanskit Text: ता नो विश्वानि जरिता ममत्तु परातरं सुनिरतिर्जिहीताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā no viśvāni jaritā mamattu parātaraṃ sunirtirjihītām ||
Translation: All these our doings shall delight the singer. Let Nirrti depart to distant places.

Sanskit Text: अभी षवर्यः पौंस्यैर्भवेम दयौर्न भूमिं गिरयोनाज्रन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhī ṣvaryaḥ pauṃsyairbhavema dyaurna bhūmiṃ ghirayonājran |
Translation: 3 May we o’ercome our foes with acts of valour, as heaven is over earth, hills over lowlands.

Sanskit Text: ता नो विश्वानि जरिता चिकेत परातरं सुनिरतिर्जिहीताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā no viśvāni jaritā ciketa parātaraṃ sunirtirjihītām ||
Translation: All these our deeds the singer hath considered. Let Nirrti depart to distant places.

Sanskit Text: मो षु णः सोम मर्त्यवे परा दाः पश्येम नु सूर्यमुच्चरन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mo ṣu ṇaḥ soma mṛtyave parā dāḥ paśyema nu sūryamuccarantam |
Translation: 4 Give us not up as prey to death, O Soma still let us look upon the Sun arising.

Sanskit Text: दयुभिर्हितो जरिमा सू नो अस्तु परातरं सुनिरतिर्जिहीताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyubhirhito jarimā sū no astu parātaraṃ sunirtirjihītām ||
Translation: Let our old age with passing days be kindly. Let Nirrti depart to distant places.

Sanskit Text: असुनीते मनो अस्मासु धारय जीवातवे सु पर तिरा नायुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asunīte mano asmāsu dhāraya jīvātave su pra tirā naāyuḥ |
Translation: 5 O Asuniti, keep the soul within us, and make the days we have to live yet longer.

Sanskit Text: रारन्धि नः सूर्यस्य सन्द्र्शि घर्तेन तवन्तन्वं वर्धयस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rārandhi naḥ sūryasya sandṛśi ghṛtena tvantanvaṃ vardhayasva ||
Translation: Grant that we still may look upon the sunlight: strengthen thy body with the oil we bring thee.

Sanskit Text: असुनीते पुनरस्मासु चक्षुः पुनः पराणमिह नो धेहिभोगम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asunīte punarasmāsu cakṣuḥ punaḥ prāṇamiha no dhehibhogham |
Translation: 6 Give us our sight again, O Asuniti, give us again our breath and our enjoyment.

Sanskit Text: जयोक पश्येम सूर्यमुच्चरन्तमनुमते मर्ळया नह्स्वस्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyok paśyema sūryamuccarantamanumate mṛḷayā nahsvasti ||
Translation: Long may we look upon the Sun uprising; O Anumati, favour thou and bless us.

Sanskit Text: पुनर्नो असुं पर्थिवी ददातु पुनर्द्यौर्देवी पुनरन्तरिक्षम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: punarno asuṃ pṛthivī dadātu punardyaurdevī punarantarikṣam |
Translation: 7 May Earth restore to us our vital spirit, may Heaven the Goddess and mid-air restore it.

Sanskit Text: पुनर्नः सोमस्तन्वं ददातु पुनः पूषापथ्यां या सवस्तिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: punarnaḥ somastanvaṃ dadātu punaḥ pūṣāpathyāṃ yā svastiḥ ||
Translation: May Soma give us once again our body, and Pūṣan show the Path of peace and comfort.

Sanskit Text: शं रोदसी सुबन्धवे यह्वी रतस्य मातरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ rodasī subandhave yahvī ṛtasya mātarā |
Translation: 8 May both Worlds bless Subandhu, young Mothers of everlasting Law.

Sanskit Text: भरतामप यद रपो दयौः पर्थिवि कषमा रपो मो षु ते किंचनाममत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharatāmapa yad rapo dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamā rapo mo ṣu te kiṃcanāmamat ||
Translation: May Heaven and Earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away: nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.

Sanskit Text: अव दवके अव तरिका दिवश्चरन्ति भेषजा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava dvake ava trikā divaścaranti bheṣajā |
Translation: 9 Health-giving medicines descend sent down from heaven in twos and threes,

Sanskit Text: कषमाचरिष्ण्वेककं भरतामप यद रपो दयौः पर्थिवि कषमारपो मो षु ते किं चनाममत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣamācariṣṇvekakaṃ bharatāmapa yad rapo dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamārapo mo ṣu te kiṃ canāmamat ||
Translation: Or wandering singly on the earth. May Heaven and Earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away: nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.

Sanskit Text: समिन्द्रेरय गामनड्वाहं य आवहदुशीनराण्यानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samindreraya ghāmanaḍvāhaṃ ya āvahaduśīnarāṇyāanaḥ |
Translation: 10 Drive forward thou the wagon-ox, O Indra, which brought Usinarani's wagon hither.

Sanskit Text: भरतामप यद रपो दयौः पर्थिवि कषमा रपो मोषु ते किं चनाममत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharatāmapa yad rapo dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamā rapo moṣu te kiṃ canāmamat ||
Translation: May Heaven and Earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away: nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.

Sanskit Text: आ जनं तवेषसन्द्र्शं माहीनानामुपस्तुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā janaṃ tveṣasandṛśaṃ māhīnānāmupastutam |
Translation: 1. BRINGING our homage we have come to one magnificent in look.

Sanskit Text: अगन्मबिभ्रतो नमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghanmabibhrato namaḥ ||
Translation: Glorified of the mighty Gods

Sanskit Text: असमातिं नितोशनं तवेषं निययिनं रथम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asamātiṃ nitośanaṃ tveṣaṃ niyayinaṃ ratham |
Translation: 2 To Asamati, spring of gifts, lord of the brave, a radiant car,

Sanskit Text: भजेरथस्य सत्पतिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhajerathasya satpatim ||
Translation: The conqueror of Bhajeratha

Sanskit Text: यो जनान महिषानिवातितस्थौ पवीरवान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo janān mahiṣānivātitasthau pavīravān |
Translation: 3 Who, when the spear hath armed his hand, or even weaponless o’erthrows

Sanskit Text: उतापवीरवान्युधा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utāpavīravānyudhā ||
Translation: Men strong as buffaloes in fight;

Sanskit Text: यस्येक्ष्वाकुरुप वरते रेवान मराय्येधते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasyekṣvākurupa vrate revān marāyyedhate |
Translation: 4 Him in whose service flourishes Iksvaku, rich and dazzling-bright.

Sanskit Text: दिवीवपञ्च कर्ष्टयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divīvapañca kṛṣṭayaḥ ||
Translation: As the Five Tribes that are in heaven.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र कषत्रासमातिषु रथप्रोष्ठेषु धारय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra kṣatrāsamātiṣu rathaproṣṭheṣu dhāraya |
Translation: 5 Indra, support the princely power of Rathaprosthas matched by none,

Sanskit Text: दिवीवसूर्यं दर्शे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divīvasūryaṃ dṛśe ||
Translation: Even as the Sun for all to see.

Sanskit Text: अगस्त्यस्य नद्भ्यः सप्ती युनक्षि रोहिता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghastyasya nadbhyaḥ saptī yunakṣi rohitā |
Translation: 6 Thou for Agastya's sister's sons yokest thy pair of ruddy steeds.

Sanskit Text: पणीन नयक्रमीरभि विश्वान राजन्नराधसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: paṇīn nyakramīrabhi viśvān rājannarādhasaḥ ||
Translation: Thou troddest niggards under foot, all those, O King, who brought no gifts.

Sanskit Text: अयं मातायं पितायं जीवातुरागमत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ mātāyaṃ pitāyaṃ jīvāturāghamat |
Translation: 7 This is the mother, this the sire, this one hath come to be thy life.

Sanskit Text: इदं तवप्रसर्पणं सुबन्धवेहि निरिहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ tavaprasarpaṇaṃ subandhavehi nirihi ||
Translation: What brings thee forth is even this. Now come, Subandhu, get thee forth.

Sanskit Text: यथा युगं वरत्रया नह्यन्ति धरुणाय कम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā yughaṃ varatrayā nahyanti dharuṇāya kam |
Translation: 8 As with the leather thong they bind the chariot yoke to hold it fast,

Sanskit Text: एवादाधार ते मनो जीवातवे न मर्त्यवे.अथो अरिष्टतातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evādādhāra te mano jīvātave na mṛtyave.atho ariṣṭatātaye ||
Translation: So have I held thy spirit fast, held it for life and not for death, held it for thy security.

Sanskit Text: यथेयं पर्थिवी मही दाधारेमान वनस्पतीन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatheyaṃ pṛthivī mahī dādhāremān vanaspatīn |
Translation: 9 Even as this earth, the mighty earth, holds fast the monarchs of the wood.

Sanskit Text: एवादाधार ते मनो जीवातवे न मर्त्यवे.अथो अरिष्टतातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evādādhāra te mano jīvātave na mṛtyave.atho ariṣṭatātaye ||
Translation: So have I held thy spirit fast, held it for life and not for death, held it for thy security.

Sanskit Text: यमादहं वैवस्वतात सुबन्धोर्मन आभरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamādahaṃ vaivasvatāt subandhormana ābharam |
Translation: 10 Subandlin's spirit I have brought from Yarna, from Vivasvān's Son,

Sanskit Text: जीवातवेन मर्त्यवे.अथो अरिष्टतातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jīvātavena mṛtyave.atho ariṣṭatātaye ||
Translation: Brought it for life and not for death, yea, brought it for security.

Sanskit Text: नयग वातो.अव वाति नयक तपति सूर्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nyagh vāto.ava vāti nyak tapati sūryaḥ |
Translation: 11 The wind blows downward from on high, downward the Sun-God sends his heat,

Sanskit Text: नीचीनमघ्न्यादुहे नयग भवतु ते रपः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nīcīnamaghnyāduhe nyagh bhavatu te rapaḥ ||
Translation: Downward the milch-cow pours her milk: so downward go thy pain and grief.

Sanskit Text: अयं मे हस्तो भगवानयं मे भगवत्तरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ me hasto bhaghavānayaṃ me bhaghavattaraḥ |
Translation: 12 Felicitous is this mine hand, yet more felicitous is this.

Sanskit Text: अयं मेविश्वभेषजो.अयं शिवाभिमर्शनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ meviśvabheṣajo.ayaṃ śivābhimarśanaḥ ||
Translation: This hand contains all healing balms, and this makes whole with gentle touch.

Sanskit Text: परावतो ये दिधिषन्त आप्यं मनुप्रीतासो जनिमाविवस्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parāvato ye didhiṣanta āpyaṃ manuprītāso janimāvivasvataḥ |
Translation: 1. MAY they who would assume kinship from far away, Vivasvān's generations, dearly loved of men,

Sanskit Text: ययातेर्ये नहुष्यस्य बर्हिषि देवा आसते तेधि बरुवन्तु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayāterye nahuṣyasya barhiṣi devā āsate teadhi bruvantu naḥ ||
Translation: Even the Gods who sit upon the sacred grass of Nahuṣa's son Yayāti, bless and comfort us.

Sanskit Text: विश्वा हि वो नमस्यानि वन्द्या नामानि देवा उत यज्ञियानिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvā hi vo namasyāni vandyā nāmāni devā uta yajñiyānivaḥ |
Translation: 2 For worthy of obeisance, Gods, are all your names, worthy of adoration and of sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: ये सथ जाता अदितेरब्ध्यस परि ये पर्थिव्यास्तेम इह शरुता हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye stha jātā aditerabdhyas pari ye pṛthivyāstema iha śrutā havam ||
Translation: Ye who were born from waters, and from Aditi, and from the earth, do ye here listen to my call.

Sanskit Text: येभ्यो माता मधुमत पिन्वते पयः पीयूषं दयौरदितिरद्रिबर्हाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yebhyo mātā madhumat pinvate payaḥ pīyūṣaṃ dyauraditiradribarhāḥ |
Translation: 3 I will rejoice in these Ādityas for my weal, for whom the Mother pours forth water rich in balm,

Sanskit Text: उक्थशुष्मान वर्षभरान सवप्नसस्तानादित्याननु मदा सवस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ukthaśuṣmān vṛṣabharān svapnasastānādityānanu madā svastaye ||
Translation: And Dyaus the Infinite, firm as a rock, sweet milk,—Gods active, strong through lauds, whose might the Bull upholds.

Sanskit Text: नर्चक्षसो अनिमिषन्तो अर्हणा बर्हद देवासो अम्र्तत्वमानशुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛcakṣaso animiṣanto arhaṇā bṛhad devāso amṛtatvamānaśuḥ |
Translation: 4 Looking on men, ne’er slumbering, they by their deserts attained as Gods to lofty immortality.

Sanskit Text: जयोतीरथा अहिमाया अनागसो दिवो वर्ष्माणंवसते सवस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyotīrathā ahimāyā anāghaso divo varṣmāṇaṃvasate svastaye ||
Translation: Borne on refulgent cars, sinless, with serpents' powers, they robe them, for our welfare, in the height of heaven.

Sanskit Text: सम्राजो ये सुव्र्धो यज्ञमाययुरपरिह्व्र्ता दधिरे दिविक्षयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samrājo ye suvṛdho yajñamāyayuraparihvṛtā dadhire divikṣayam |
Translation: 5 Great Kings who bless us, who have come to sacrifice, who, ne’er assailed, have set their mansion in the sky,—

Sanskit Text: ताना विवास नमसा सुव्र्क्तिभिर्महो आदित्यानदितिं सवस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tānā vivāsa namasā suvṛktibhirmaho ādityānaditiṃ svastaye ||
Translation: These I invite with adoration and with hymns, mighty Ādityas, Aditi, for happiness.

Sanskit Text: को व सतोमं राधति यं जुजोषथ विश्वे देवासो मनुषोयति षठन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko va stomaṃ rādhati yaṃ jujoṣatha viśve devāso manuṣoyati ṣṭhana |
Translation: 6 Who offereth to you the laud that ye accept, O ye All-Gods of Manu, many as ye are?

Sanskit Text: को वो.अध्वरं तुविजाता अरं करद यो नःपर्षदत्यंहः सवस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko vo.adhvaraṃ tuvijātā araṃ karad yo naḥparṣadatyaṃhaḥ svastaye ||
Translation: Who, Mighty Ones, will prepare for you the sacrifice to bear us over trouble to felicity?

Sanskit Text: येभ्यो होत्रां परथमामायेजे मनुः समिद्धाग्निर्मनसासप्त होत्र्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yebhyo hotrāṃ prathamāmāyeje manuḥ samiddhāghnirmanasāsapta hotṛbhiḥ |
Translation: 7 Ye to whom Manu, by seven priests, with kindled fire, offered the first oblation with his heart and soul,

Sanskit Text: त आदित्या अभयं शर्म यछत सुगा नःकर्त सुपथा सवस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta ādityā abhayaṃ śarma yachata sughā naḥkarta supathā svastaye ||
Translation: Vouchsafe us, ye Ādityas, sheitcr free from fear, and make us good and easy paths to happiness.

Sanskit Text: य ईशिरे भुवनस्य परचेतसो विश्वस्य सथातुर्जगतश्चमन्तवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya īśire bhuvanasya pracetaso viśvasya sthāturjaghataścamantavaḥ |
Translation: 8 Wise Deities, who have dominion o’er the world, ye thinkers over all that moves not and that moves,

Sanskit Text: ते नः कर्तादक्र्तादेनसस पर्यद्या देवासःपिप्र्ता सवस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te naḥ kṛtādakṛtādenasas paryadyā devāsaḥpipṛtā svastaye ||
Translation: Save us from uncommitted and committed sin, preserve us from all sin to-day for happiness.

Sanskit Text: भरेष्विन्द्रं सुहवं हवामहे.अंहोमुचं सुक्र्तन्दैव्यं जनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhareṣvindraṃ suhavaṃ havāmahe.aṃhomucaṃ sukṛtandaivyaṃ janam |
Translation: 9 In battles we invoke Indra still swift to hear, and all the holy Host of Heaven who banish grief,

Sanskit Text: अग्निं मित्रं वरुणं सातये भगन्द्यावाप्र्थिवी मरुतः सवस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ mitraṃ varuṇaṃ sātaye bhaghandyāvāpṛthivī marutaḥ svastaye ||
Translation: Agni, Mitra, and Varuṇa that we may gain, Dyays, Bhaga, Maruts, Prthivi for happiness:

Sanskit Text: सुत्रामाणं पर्थिवीं दयामनेहसं सुशर्माणमदितिंसुप्रणीतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sutrāmāṇaṃ pṛthivīṃ dyāmanehasaṃ suśarmāṇamaditiṃsupraṇītim |
Translation: 10 Mightily-saving Earth, incomparable Heaven the good guide Aditi who gives secure defence

Sanskit Text: दैवीं नावं सवरित्रामनागसमस्रवन्तीमा रुहेमा सवस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: daivīṃ nāvaṃ svaritrāmanāghasamasravantīmā ruhemā svastaye ||
Translation: The well-oared heavenly Ship that lets no waters in, free from defect, will we ascend for happiness.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे यजत्रा अधि वोचतोतये तरायध्वं नो दुरेवायाभिह्रुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve yajatrā adhi vocatotaye trāyadhvaṃ no durevāyāabhihrutaḥ |
Translation: 11 Bless us, all Holy Ones, that we may have your help, guard and protect us from malignant injury.

Sanskit Text: सत्यया वो देवहूत्या हुवेम शर्ण्वतो देवावसे सवस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satyayā vo devahūtyā huvema śṛṇvato devāavase svastaye ||
Translation: With fruitful invocation may we call on you, Gods, who give ear to us for grace, for happiness.

Sanskit Text: अपामीवामप विश्वामनाहुतिमपारातिं दुर्विदत्रामघायतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāmīvāmapa viśvāmanāhutimapārātiṃ durvidatrāmaghāyataḥ |
Translation: 12 Keep all disease afar and sordid sacrifice, keep off the wicked man's malicious enmity.

Sanskit Text: आरे देवा दवेषो अस्मद युयोतनोरु णः शर्मयछता सवस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āre devā dveṣo asmad yuyotanoru ṇaḥ śarmayachatā svastaye ||
Translation: Keep far away from us all hatred, O ye Gods, and give us ample shelter for our happiness.

Sanskit Text: अरिष्टः स मर्तो विश्व एधते पर परजाभिर्जायतेधर्मणस परि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ariṣṭaḥ sa marto viśva edhate pra prajābhirjāyatedharmaṇas pari |
Translation: 13 Untouched by any evil, every mortal thrives, and, following the Law, spreads in his progeny.

Sanskit Text: यमादित्यासो नयथा सुनीतिभिरतिविश्वानि दुरिता सवस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamādityāso nayathā sunītibhirativiśvāni duritā svastaye ||
Translation: Whom ye with your good guidance, O Ādityas, lead safely through all his pain and grief to happiness.

Sanskit Text: यं देवासो.अवथ वाजसातौ यं शूरसाता मरुतो हितेधने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ devāso.avatha vājasātau yaṃ śūrasātā maruto hitedhane |
Translation: 14 That which ye guard and grace in battle, O ye Gods, ye Maruts, where the prize is wealth, where heroes win,

Sanskit Text: परातर्यावाणं रथमिन्द्र सानसिमरिष्यन्तमारुहेमा सवस्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prātaryāvāṇaṃ rathamindra sānasimariṣyantamāruhemā svastaye ||
