Translation: That conquering Car, O Indra, that sets forth at dawn, that never breaks, may we ascend for happiness.

Sanskit Text: सवस्ति नः पथ्यासु धन्वसु सवस्त्यप्सु वर्जने सवर्वति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svasti naḥ pathyāsu dhanvasu svastyapsu vṛjane svarvati |
Translation: 15 Vouchsafe us blessing in our paths and desert tracts, blessing in waters and in battle, for the light;

Sanskit Text: सवस्ति नः पुत्रक्र्थेषु योनिषु सवस्ति राये मरुतो दधातन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svasti naḥ putrakṛtheṣu yoniṣu svasti rāye maruto dadhātana ||
Translation: Blessing upon the wombs that bring male children forth, and blessing, O ye Maruts, for the gain of wealth.

Sanskit Text: सवस्तिरिद धि परपथे शरेष्ठा रेक्णस्वत्यभि यावाममेति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svastirid dhi prapathe śreṣṭhā rekṇasvatyabhi yāvāmameti |
Translation: 16 The noblest Svasti with abundant riches, who comes to what is good by distant pathway,—

Sanskit Text: सा नो अमा सो अरणे नि पातु सवावेशा भवतुदेवगोपा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā no amā so araṇe ni pātu svāveśā bhavatudevaghopā ||
Translation: May she at home and far away preserve us, and dwell with us under the Gods’ protection

Sanskit Text: एवा पलतेः सूनुरवीव्र्धद वो विश्व आदित्या अदितेमनीषी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā plateḥ sūnuravīvṛdhad vo viśva ādityā aditemanīṣī |
Translation: 17 Thus hatb the thoughtful sage, the son of Plati, praised you, O Aditi and all Ādityas,

Sanskit Text: ईशानासो नरो अमर्त्येनास्तावि जनो दिव्योगयेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: īśānāso naro amartyenāstāvi jano divyoghayena ||
Translation: Men are made rich by those who are Immortal: the Heavenly Folk have been extolled by Gaya.

Sanskit Text: अग्निरिन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा वायुः पूषा सरस्वतीसजोषसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirindro varuṇo mitro aryamā vāyuḥ pūṣā sarasvatīsajoṣasaḥ |
Translation: 1. MAY Agni, Indra, Mitra, Varuṇa consent, Aryaman, Vāyu, Pūṣan, and Sarasvatī,

Sanskit Text: आदित्या विष्णुर्मरुतः सवर्ब्र्हत सोमो रुद्रोदितिर्ब्रह्मणस पतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityā viṣṇurmarutaḥ svarbṛhat somo rudroaditirbrahmaṇas patiḥ ||
Translation: Ādityas, Maruts, Viṣṇu, Soma, lofty Sky, Rudra and Aditi, and Brahmaṇaspati.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्राग्नी वर्त्रहत्येषु सत्पती मिथो हिन्वाना तन्वासमोकसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrāghnī vṛtrahatyeṣu satpatī mitho hinvānā tanvāsamokasā |
Translation: 2 Indra and Agni, Hero-lords when Vṛtra fell, dwelling together, speeding emulously on,

Sanskit Text: अन्तरिक्षं मह्या पप्रुरोजसा सोमो घर्तश्रीर्महिमानमीरयन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: antarikṣaṃ mahyā paprurojasā somo ghṛtaśrīrmahimānamīrayan ||
Translation: And Soma blent with oil, putting his greatness forth, have with their power filled full the mighty firmament.

Sanskit Text: तेषां हि मह्ना महतामनर्वणां सतोमानियर्म्य्र्तज्ञा रताव्र्धाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: teṣāṃ hi mahnā mahatāmanarvaṇāṃ stomāniyarmyṛtajñā ṛtāvṛdhām |
Translation: 3 Skilled in the Law I lift the hymn of praise to these, Law-strengtheners, unassailed, and great in majesty.

Sanskit Text: ये अप्सवमर्णवं चित्रराधसस्तेनो रासन्तां महये सुमित्र्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye apsavamarṇavaṃ citrarādhasasteno rāsantāṃ mahaye sumitryāḥ ||
Translation: These in their wondrous bounty send the watery sea: may they as kindly Friends send gifts to make us great.

Sanskit Text: सवर्णरमन्तरिक्षाणि रोचना दयावाभूमी पर्थिवींस्कम्भुरोजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svarṇaramantarikṣāṇi rocanā dyāvābhūmī pṛthivīṃskambhurojasā |
Translation: 4 They with their might have stayed Heaven, Earth, and Prthivi, the Lord of Light, the firmament, -the lustrous spheres.

Sanskit Text: पर्क्षा इव महयन्तः सुरातयो देवास्तवन्ते मनुषाय सूरयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛkṣā iva mahayantaḥ surātayo devāstavante manuṣāya sūrayaḥ ||
Translation: Even as fleet-foot steeds who make their masters glad, the princely Gods are praised, most bountiful to man.

Sanskit Text: मित्राय शिक्ष वरुणाय दाशुषे या सम्राजा मनसा नप्रयुछतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitrāya śikṣa varuṇāya dāśuṣe yā samrājā manasā naprayuchataḥ |
Translation: 5 Bring gifts to Mitra and to Varuṇa who, Lords of all, in spirit never fail the worshipper,

Sanskit Text: ययोर्धाम धर्मणा रोचते बर्हद ययोरुभेरोदसी नाधसी वर्तौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayordhāma dharmaṇā rocate bṛhad yayorubherodasī nādhasī vṛtau ||
Translation: Whose statute shines on high through everlasting Law, whose places of sure refuge are the heavens and earth.

Sanskit Text: या गौर्वर्तनिं पर्येति निष्क्र्तं पयो दुहाना वरतनीरवारतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā ghaurvartaniṃ paryeti niṣkṛtaṃ payo duhānā vratanīravārataḥ |
Translation: 6 The cow who yielding milk goes her appointed way hither to us as leader of holy rites,

Sanskit Text: सा परब्रुवाणा वरुणाय दाशुषे देवेभ्योदाशद धविषा विवस्वते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā prabruvāṇā varuṇāya dāśuṣe devebhyodāśad dhaviṣā vivasvate ||
Translation: Speaking aloud to Varuṇa and the worshipper, shall with oblation serve Vivasvān and the Gods.

Sanskit Text: दिवक्षसो अग्निजिह्वा रताव्र्ध रतस्य योनिं विम्र्शन्त आसते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divakṣaso aghnijihvā ṛtāvṛdha ṛtasya yoniṃ vimṛśanta āsate |
Translation: 7 The Gods whose tongue is Agni dwell in heaven, and sit, aiders of Law, reflecting, in the seat of Law.

Sanskit Text: दयां सकभित्व्यप आ चक्रुरोजसा यज्ञं जनित्वीतन्वी नि माम्र्जुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyāṃ skabhitvyapa ā cakrurojasā yajñaṃ janitvītanvī ni māmṛjuḥ ||
Translation: They propped up heaven and then brought waters with their might, got sacrifice and in a body made it fair.

Sanskit Text: परिक्षिता पितरा पूर्वजावरी रतस्य योना कषयतःसमोकसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parikṣitā pitarā pūrvajāvarī ṛtasya yonā kṣayataḥsamokasā |
Translation: 8 Born in the oldest time, the Parents dwelling round are sharers of one mansion in the home of Law.

Sanskit Text: दयावाप्र्थिवी वरुणाय सव्रते घर्तवत पयोमहिषाय पिन्वतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇāya savrate ghṛtavat payomahiṣāya pinvataḥ ||
Translation: Bound by their common vow Dyaus, Prthivi stream forth the moisture rich in oil to Varuṇa the Steer.

Sanskit Text: पर्जन्यावाता वर्षभा पुरीषिणेन्द्रवायू वरुणो मित्रोर्यमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parjanyāvātā vṛṣabhā purīṣiṇendravāyū varuṇo mitroaryamā |
Translation: 9 Parjanya, Vāta, mighty, senders of the rain, Indra and Vāyu, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman:

Sanskit Text: देवानादित्यानदितिं हवामहे ये पार्थिवासोदिव्यासो अप्सु ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānādityānaditiṃ havāmahe ye pārthivāsodivyāso apsu ye ||
Translation: We call on Aditi, Ādityas, and the Gods, those who are on the earth, in waters, and in heaven.

Sanskit Text: तवष्टारं वायुं रभवो य ओहते दैव्या होतारा उषसंस्वस्तये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṣṭāraṃ vāyuṃ ṛbhavo ya ohate daivyā hotārā uṣasaṃsvastaye |
Translation: 10 Tvaṣṭar and Vāyu, those who count as Ṛbhus, both celestial Hotar-priests, and Dawn for happiness,

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिं वर्त्रखादं सुमेधसमिन्द्रियंसोमं धनसा उ ईमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiṃ vṛtrakhādaṃ sumedhasamindriyaṃsomaṃ dhanasā u īmahe ||
Translation: Winners of wealth, we call, and wise Bṛhaspati, destroyer of our foes, and Soma Indra's Friend.

Sanskit Text: बरह्म गामश्वं जनयन्त ओषधीर्वनस्पतीन पर्थिवीम्पर्वतानपः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahma ghāmaśvaṃ janayanta oṣadhīrvanaspatīn pṛthivīmparvatānapaḥ |
Translation: 11 They generated prayer, the cow, the horse, the plants, the forest trees, the earth, the waters, and the hills.

Sanskit Text: सूर्यं दिवि रोहयन्तः सुदानव आर्याव्रता विस्र्जन्तो अधि कषमि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūryaṃ divi rohayantaḥ sudānava āryāvratā visṛjanto adhi kṣami ||
Translation: These very bounteous Gods made the Sun mount to heaven, and spread the righteous laws of Āryas o’er the land.

Sanskit Text: भुज्युमंहसः पिप्र्थो निरश्विना शयावं पुत्रंवध्रिमत्या अजिन्वतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhujyumaṃhasaḥ pipṛtho niraśvinā śyāvaṃ putraṃvadhrimatyā ajinvatam |
Translation: 12 O Aśvins, ye delivered Bhujyu from distress, ye animated Śyāva, Vadhrmati's son.

Sanskit Text: कमद्युवं विमदायोहथुर्युवंविष्णाप्वं विश्वकायाव सर्जथः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kamadyuvaṃ vimadāyohathuryuvaṃviṣṇāpvaṃ viśvakāyāva sṛjathaḥ ||
Translation: To Vimada ye brought his consort Kamadyu, and gave his lost Viṣṇāpū back to Viśvaka.

Sanskit Text: पावीरवी तन्यतुरेकपादजो दिवो धर्ता सिन्धुरापःसमुद्रियः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāvīravī tanyaturekapādajo divo dhartā sindhurāpaḥsamudriyaḥ |
Translation: 13 Thunder, the lightning's daughter, Aja-Ekapād, heaven's bearer, Sindhu, and the waters of the sea:

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवासः शर्णवन वचांसि मे सरस्वतीसह धीभिः पुरन्ध्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devāsaḥ śṛṇavan vacāṃsi me sarasvatīsaha dhībhiḥ purandhyā ||
Translation: Hear all the Gods my words, Sarasvatī give ear together with Purandhi and with Holy Thoughts.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवाः सह धीभिः पुरन्ध्या मनोर्यजत्राम्र्ता रतज्ञाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devāḥ saha dhībhiḥ purandhyā manoryajatrāamṛtā ṛtajñāḥ |
Translation: 14 With Holy Thoughts and with Purandhi may all Gods, knowing the Law immortal, Manu's Holy Ones,

Sanskit Text: रातिषाचो अभिषाचः सवर्विदः सवर्गिरो बरह्म सूक्तं जुषेरत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rātiṣāco abhiṣācaḥ svarvidaḥ svarghiro brahma sūktaṃ juṣerata ||
Translation: Boon-givers, favourers, finders of light, and Heaven, with gracious love accept my songs, my prayer, my hymn.

Sanskit Text: देवान वसिष्ठो अम्र्तान ववन्दे ये विश्वा भुवनाभिप्रतस्थुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devān vasiṣṭho amṛtān vavande ye viśvā bhuvanābhipratasthuḥ |
Translation: 15 Immortal Gods have I, Vasiṣṭha, lauded, Gods set on high above all other beings.

Sanskit Text: ते नो रासन्तामुरुगायमद्य यूयं पातस्वस्तिभिः सदा नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te no rāsantāmurughāyamadya yūyaṃ pātasvastibhiḥ sadā naḥ ||
Translation: May they this day grant us wide space and freedom: ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

Sanskit Text: इमां धियं सप्तशीर्ष्णीं पिता न रतप्रजातां बर्हतीमविन्दत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imāṃ dhiyaṃ saptaśīrṣṇīṃ pitā na ṛtaprajātāṃ bṛhatīmavindat |
Translation: 1. THIS holy hymn, sublime and sevenheaded, sprung from eternal Law, our sire discovered.

Sanskit Text: तुरीयं सविज्जनयद विश्वजन्यो.अयास्य उक्थमिन्द्राय शंसन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: turīyaṃ svijjanayad viśvajanyo.ayāsya ukthamindrāya śaṃsan ||
Translation: Ayasya, friend of all men, hath engendered the fourth hymn as he sang his laud to Indra.

Sanskit Text: रतं शंसन्त रजु दीध्याना दिवस पुत्रासो असुरस्यवीराः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtaṃ śaṃsanta ṛju dīdhyānā divas putrāso asurasyavīrāḥ |
Translation: 2 Thinking aright, praising eternal Order, the sons of Dyaus the Asura, those heroes,

Sanskit Text: विप्रं पदमङगिरसो दधाना यज्ञस्य धामप्रथमं मनन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vipraṃ padamaṅghiraso dadhānā yajñasya dhāmaprathamaṃ mananta ||
Translation: Aṅgirases, holding the rank of sages, first honoured sacrifice's holy statute.

Sanskit Text: हंसैरिव सखिभिर्वावदद्भिरश्मन्मयानि नहनाव्यस्यन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: haṃsairiva sakhibhirvāvadadbhiraśmanmayāni nahanāvyasyan |
Translation: 3 Girt by his friends who cried with swanlike voices, bursting the stony barriers of the prison,

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिरभिकनिक्रदद गा उत परास्तौदुच्चविद्वानगायत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatirabhikanikradad ghā uta prāstauduccavidvānaghāyat ||
Translation: Bṛhaspati spake in thunder to the cattle, and uttered praise and song when he had found them.

Sanskit Text: अवो दवाभ्यां पर एकया गा गुहा तिष्ठन्तीरन्र्तस्यसेतौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avo dvābhyāṃ para ekayā ghā ghuhā tiṣṭhantīranṛtasyasetau |
Translation: 4 Apart from one, away from two above him, he drave the kine that stood in bonds of falsehood.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिस्तमसि जयोतिरिछन्नुदुस्रा आकर्विहि तिस्र आवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatistamasi jyotirichannudusrā ākarvihi tisra āvaḥ ||
Translation: Bṛhaspati, seeking light amid the darkness, drave forth the bright cows: three he made apparent.

Sanskit Text: विभिद्या पुरं शयाथेमपाचीं निस्त्रीणि साकमुदधेरक्र्न्तत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vibhidyā puraṃ śayāthemapācīṃ nistrīṇi sākamudadherakṛntat |
Translation: 5 When he had cleft the lairs and western castle, he cut off three from him who held the waters.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिरुषसं सूर्यं गामर्कंविवेद सतनयन्निव दयौः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiruṣasaṃ sūryaṃ ghāmarkaṃviveda stanayanniva dyauḥ ||
Translation: Bṛhaspati discovered, while he thundered like Dyaus, the dawn, the Sun, the cow, the lightning.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो वलं रक्षितारं दुघानां करेणेव वि चकर्तारवेण |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro valaṃ rakṣitāraṃ dughānāṃ kareṇeva vi cakartāraveṇa |
Translation: 6 As with a hand, so with his roaring Indra cleft Vala through, the guardian of the cattle.

Sanskit Text: सवेदाञ्जिभिराशिरमिछमानो.अरोदयत पणिमागा अमुष्णात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svedāñjibhirāśiramichamāno.arodayat paṇimāghā amuṣṇāt ||
Translation: Seeking the milk-draught with sweatshining comrades he stole the Paṇi's kine and left him weeping.

Sanskit Text: स ईं सत्येभिः सखिभिः शुचद्भिर्गोधायसं विधनसैरदर्दः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa īṃ satyebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ śucadbhirghodhāyasaṃ vidhanasairadardaḥ |
Translation: 7 He with bright faithful Friends, winners of booty, hath rent the milker of the cows asunder.

Sanskit Text: बरह्मणस पतिर्व्र्षभिर्वराहैर्घर्मस्वेदेभिर्द्रविणं वयानट ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmaṇas patirvṛṣabhirvarāhairgharmasvedebhirdraviṇaṃ vyānaṭ ||
Translation: Bṛhaspati with wild boars strong and mighty, sweating with heat, hath gained a rich possession.

Sanskit Text: ते सत्येन मनसा गोपतिं गा इयानास इषणयन्तधीभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te satyena manasā ghopatiṃ ghā iyānāsa iṣaṇayantadhībhiḥ |
Translation: 8 They, longing for the kine, with faithful spirit incited with their hymns the Lord of cattle.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिर्मिथोवद्यपेभिरुदुस्रिया अस्र्जतस्वयुग्भिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatirmithoavadyapebhirudusriyā asṛjatasvayughbhiḥ ||
Translation: Bṛhaspati freed the radiant cows with comrades self-yoked, averting shame from one another.

Sanskit Text: तं वर्धयन्तो मतिभिः शिवाभिः सिंअमिव नानदतंसधस्थे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vardhayanto matibhiḥ śivābhiḥ siṃamiva nānadataṃsadhasthe |
Translation: 9 In our assembly with auspicious praises exalting him who roareth like a lion,

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिं वर्षणं शूरसातौ भरे-भरे अनुमदेम जिष्णुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ śūrasātau bhare-bhare anumadema jiṣṇum ||
Translation: Maywe, in every fight where heroes conquer, rejoice in strong Bṛhaspati the Victor.

Sanskit Text: यदा वाजमसनद विश्वरूपमा दयामरुक्षदुत्तराणिसद्म |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā vājamasanad viśvarūpamā dyāmarukṣaduttarāṇisadma |
Translation: 10 When he had won him every sort of booty and gone to heaven and its most lofty mansions,

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिं वर्षणं वर्धयन्तो नाना सन्तोबिभ्रतो जयोतिरासा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vardhayanto nānā santobibhrato jyotirāsā ||
Translation: Men praised Bṛhaspati the Mighty, bringing the light within their mouths from sundry places.

Sanskit Text: सत्यामाशिषं कर्णुता वयोधै कीरिं चिद धयवथस्वेभिरेवैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: satyāmāśiṣaṃ kṛṇutā vayodhai kīriṃ cid dhyavathasvebhirevaiḥ |
Translation: 11 Fulfil the prayer that begs for vital vigour: aid in your wonted manner even the humble.

Sanskit Text: पश्चा मर्धो अप भवन्तु विश्वास्तद्रोदसी शर्णुतं विश्वमिन्वे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: paścā mṛdho apa bhavantu viśvāstadrodasī śṛṇutaṃ viśvaminve ||
Translation: Let all our foes be turned and driven backward. Hear this, O Heaven and Earth, ye All-producers.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो मह्ना महतो अर्णवस्य वि मूर्धानमभिनदर्बुदस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro mahnā mahato arṇavasya vi mūrdhānamabhinadarbudasya |
Translation: 12 Indra with mighty strength cleft asunder the head of Arbuda the watery monster,

Sanskit Text: अहन्नहिमरिणात सप्त सिन्धून देवैर्द्यावाप्र्थिवीप्रावतं नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahannahimariṇāt sapta sindhūn devairdyāvāpṛthivīprāvataṃ naḥ ||
Translation: Slain Ahi, and set free the Seven Rivers. O Heaven and Earth, with all the Gods protect us.

Sanskit Text: उदप्रुतो न वयो रक्षमाणा वावदतो अभ्रियस्येव घोषाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udapruto na vayo rakṣamāṇā vāvadato abhriyasyeva ghoṣāḥ |
Translation: 1. LIKE birds who keep their watch, plashing in water, like the loud voices of the thundering rain-cloud,

Sanskit Text: गिरिभ्रजो नोर्मयो मदन्तो बर्हस्पतिमभ्यर्का अनावन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghiribhrajo normayo madanto bṛhaspatimabhyarkā anāvan ||
Translation: Like merry streamlets bursting from the mountain, thus to Bṛhaspati our hymns have sounded.

Sanskit Text: सं गोभिराङगिरसो नक्षमाणो भग इवेदर्यमणंनिनाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ ghobhirāṅghiraso nakṣamāṇo bhagha ivedaryamaṇaṃnināya |
Translation: 2 The Son of Aṅgirases, meeting the cattle, as Bhaga, brought in Aryaman among us.

Sanskit Text: जने मित्रो न दम्पती अनक्ति बर्हस्पतेवाजयाशून्रिवाजौ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jane mitro na dampatī anakti bṛhaspatevājayāśūnrivājau ||
Translation: As Friend of men he decks the wife and husband: as for the race, Bṛhaspati, nerve our coursers.

Sanskit Text: साध्वर्या अतिथिनीरिषिरा सपार्हाः सुवर्णानवद्यरूपाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sādhvaryā atithinīriṣirā spārhāḥ suvarṇāanavadyarūpāḥ |
Translation: 3 Bṛhaspati, having won them from the mountains, strewed down, like barley out of winnowing- baskets,

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिः पर्वते भयो वितूर्या निर्गाूपे यवमिव सथिविभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiḥ parvate bhyo vitūryā nirghāūpe yavamiva sthivibhyaḥ ||
Translation: The vigorous, wandering cows who aid the pious, desired of all, of blameless form, well-coloured.

Sanskit Text: आप्रुषायन मधुन रतस्य योनिमवक्षिपन्नर्क उल्कामिवद्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpruṣāyan madhuna ṛtasya yonimavakṣipannarka ulkāmivadyoḥ |
Translation: 4 As the Sun dews with meath the seat of Order, and casts a flaming meteor down from heaven.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिरुद्धरन्नश्मनो गा भूम्या उद्नेव वित्वचं बिभेद ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiruddharannaśmano ghā bhūmyā udneva vitvacaṃ bibheda ||
Translation: So from the rock Bṛhaspati forced the cattle, and cleft the earth's skin as it were with water.

Sanskit Text: अप जयोतिषा तमो अन्तरिक्षादुद्नः शीपालमिव वाताजत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa jyotiṣā tamo antarikṣādudnaḥ śīpālamiva vātaājat |
Translation: 5 Forth from mid air with light he dravc the darkness, as the gale blows a lily from the fiver.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिरनुम्र्श्या वलस्याभ्रमिव वात आ चक्रा गाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiranumṛśyā valasyābhramiva vāta ā cakraā ghāḥ ||
Translation: Like the wind grasping at the cloud of Vala, Bṛhaspati gathered to himself the cattle,

Sanskit Text: यदा वलस्य पीयतो जसुं भेद बर्हस्पतिरग्नितपोभिरर्कैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā valasya pīyato jasuṃ bhed bṛhaspatiraghnitapobhirarkaiḥ |
Translation: 6 Bṛhaspati, when he with fiery lightnings cleft through the weapon of reviling Vala,

Sanskit Text: दद्भिर्न जिह्वा परिविष्टमाददाविर्निधीन्रक्र्णोदुस्रियाणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadbhirna jihvā pariviṣṭamādadāvirnidhīnrakṛṇodusriyāṇām ||
Translation: Consumedḥim as tongues cat what teeth have compassed: he threw the prisons of the red cows open.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिरमत हि तयदासां नाम सवरीणां सदनेगुहा यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiramata hi tyadāsāṃ nāma svarīṇāṃ sadaneghuhā yat |
Translation: 7 That secret name borne by the lowing cattle within the cave Bṛhaspati discovered,

Sanskit Text: आण्डेव भित्त्वा शकुनस्य गर्भमुदुस्रियाःपर्वतस्य तमनाजत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āṇḍeva bhittvā śakunasya gharbhamudusriyāḥparvatasya tmanājat ||
Translation: And drave, himself, the bright kine from the mountain, like a bird's young after the egg's disclosure.

Sanskit Text: अश्नापिनद्धं मधु पर्यपश्यन मत्स्यं न दीन उदनिक्षियन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśnāpinaddhaṃ madhu paryapaśyan matsyaṃ na dīna udanikṣiyantam |
Translation: 8 He looked around on rock-imprisoned sweetness as one who eyes a fish in scanty water.

Sanskit Text: निष टज्जभार चमसं न वर्क्षाद्ब्र्हस्पतिर्विरवेणा विक्र्त्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niṣ ṭajjabhāra camasaṃ na vṛkṣādbṛhaspatirviraveṇā vikṛtya ||
Translation: Bṛhaspati, cleaving through with varied clamour, brought it forth like a bowl from out the timber.

Sanskit Text: सोषामविन्दत स सवः सो अग्निं सो अर्केण वि बबाधेतमांसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: soṣāmavindat sa svaḥ so aghniṃ so arkeṇa vi babādhetamāṃsi |
Translation: 9 He found the light of heaven, and fire, and Morning: with lucid rays he forced apart the darkness.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिर्गोवपुषो वलस्य निर्मज्जानं नपर्वणो जभार ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatirghovapuṣo valasya nirmajjānaṃ naparvaṇo jabhāra ||
Translation: As from a joint, Bṛhaspati took the marrow of Vala as he gloried in his cattle.

Sanskit Text: हिमेव पर्णा मुषिता वनानि बर्हस्पतिनाक्र्पयद वलो गाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: himeva parṇā muṣitā vanāni bṛhaspatinākṛpayad valo ghāḥ |
Translation: 10 As trees for foliage robbed by winter, Vala mourned for the cows Bṛhaspati had taken.

Sanskit Text: अनानुक्र्त्यमपुनश्चकार यात सूर्यामासा मिथौच्चरातः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anānukṛtyamapunaścakāra yāt sūryāmāsā mithauccarātaḥ ||
Translation: He did a deed ne’er done, ne’er to be equalled, whereby the Sun and Moon ascend alternate.

Sanskit Text: अभि शयावं न कर्शनेभिरश्वं नक्षत्रेभिः पितरोद्यामपिंशन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi śyāvaṃ na kṛśanebhiraśvaṃ nakṣatrebhiḥ pitarodyāmapiṃśan |
Translation: 11 Like a dark steed adorned with pearl, the Fathers have decorated heaven With constellations.

Sanskit Text: रात्र्यां तमो अदधुर्ज्योतिरहन्ब्र्हस्पतिर्भिनदद्रिं विदद गाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rātryāṃ tamo adadhurjyotirahanbṛhaspatirbhinadadriṃ vidad ghāḥ ||
Translation: They set the light in day, in night the darkness. Bṛhaspati cleft the rock and found the cattle.

Sanskit Text: इदमकर्म नमो अभ्रियाय यः पूर्वीरन्वानोनवीति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idamakarma namo abhriyāya yaḥ pūrvīranvānonavīti |
Translation: 12 This homage have we.offered to the Cloud God who thunders out to many in succession.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिः स हि गोभिः सो अश्वैः स वीरेभिः सन्र्भिर्नो वयो धात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiḥ sa hi ghobhiḥ so aśvaiḥ sa vīrebhiḥ sanṛbhirno vayo dhāt ||
Translation: May this Bṛhaspati vouchsafe us fulness of life with kine and horses, men, and heroes.

Sanskit Text: इमां मे अग्ने समिधं जुषस्वेळस पदे परति हर्याघ्र्ताचीम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imāṃ me aghne samidhaṃ juṣasveḷas pade prati haryāghṛtācīm |
Translation: 1. ENJOY, O Agni, this my Fuel, welcome the oil-filled ladle where we pour libation.

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्मन पर्थिव्याः सुदिनत्वे अह्नामूर्ध्वोभव सुक्रतो देवयज्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: varṣman pṛthivyāḥ sudinatve ahnāmūrdhvobhava sukrato devayajyā ||
Translation: Rise up for worship of the Gods, wise Agni, on the earth's height, while days are bright with beauty.

Sanskit Text: आ देवानामग्रयावेह यातु नराशंसो विश्वरूपेभिरश्वैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā devānāmaghrayāveha yātu narāśaṃso viśvarūpebhiraśvaiḥ |
Translation: 2 May he who goes before the Gods come hither with steeds whose shapes are varied, Narasarhsa.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य पथा नमसा मियेधो देवेभ्यो देवतमःसुषूदत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya pathā namasā miyedho devebhyo devatamaḥsuṣūdat ||
Translation: May he, most Godlike, speed our offered viands with homage God-ward on the path of Order.

Sanskit Text: शश्वत्तममीळते दूत्याय हविष्मन्तो मनुष्यासो अग्निम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaśvattamamīḷate dūtyāya haviṣmanto manuṣyāso aghnim |
Translation: 3 Men with oblations laud most constant Agni, and pray him to perform an envoy's duty.

Sanskit Text: वहिष्ठैरश्वैः सुव्र्ता रथेना देवान वक्षि निषदेह होता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vahiṣṭhairaśvaiḥ suvṛtā rathenā devān vakṣi niṣadeha hotā ||
Translation: With lightly-rolling car and best draught-horses, bring the Gods hither and sit down as Hotar.

Sanskit Text: वि परथतां देवजुष्टं तिरश्चा दीर्घं दराघ्मासुरभि भूत्वस्मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi prathatāṃ devajuṣṭaṃ tiraścā dīrghaṃ drāghmāsurabhi bhūtvasme |
Translation: 4 May the delight of Gods spread out transversely: may it be with us long in length and fragrant.

Sanskit Text: अहेळता मनसा देव बर्हिरिन्द्रज्येष्ठानुशतो यक्षि देवान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aheḷatā manasā deva barhirindrajyeṣṭhānuśato yakṣi devān ||
Translation: O Holy Grass divine, with friendly spirit bring thou the willing Gods whose Chief is Indra.

Sanskit Text: दिवो वा सानु सप्र्शता वरीयः पर्थिव्या वा मात्रया विश्रयध्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divo vā sānu spṛśatā varīyaḥ pṛthivyā vā mātrayā viśrayadhvam |
Translation: 5 Touch ye the far-extending height of heaven or spring apart to suit the wide earth's measure.

Sanskit Text: उशतीर्द्वारो महिना महद्भिर्देवं रथंरथयुर्धारयध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uśatīrdvāro mahinā mahadbhirdevaṃ rathaṃrathayurdhārayadhvam ||
Translation: Yearning, ye Doors, with those sublime in greatness, seize eagerly the heavenly Car that cometh.

Sanskit Text: देवी दिवो दुहितरा सुशिल्पे उषासानक्ता सदतां नियोनौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devī divo duhitarā suśilpe uṣāsānaktā sadatāṃ niyonau |
Translation: 6 Here in this shrine may Dawn and Night, the Daughters of Heaven, the skilful Goddesses, be seated.

Sanskit Text: आ वां देवास उशती उशन्त उरौ सीदन्तु सुभगेुपस्थे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ devāsa uśatī uśanta urau sīdantu subhagheupasthe ||
Translation: In your wide lap, auspicious, willing Ladies may the Gods seat them with a willing spirit.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वो गरावा बर्हदग्निः समिद्धः परिया धामान्यदितेरुपस्थे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvo ghrāvā bṛhadaghniḥ samiddhaḥ priyā dhāmānyaditerupasthe |
Translation: 7 Up stands the stone, high burns the fire enkindled: Aditi's lap contains the Friendly Natures

Sanskit Text: पुरोहिताव रत्विजा यज्ञे अस्मिन विदुष्टराद्रविणमा यजेथाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purohitāv ṛtvijā yajñe asmin viduṣṭarādraviṇamā yajethām ||
Translation: Ye Two Chief Priests who serve at this our worship, may ye, more skilled, win for us rich possessions.

Sanskit Text: तिस्रो देवीर्बर्हिरिदं वरीय आ सीदत चक्र्मा वःस्योनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisro devīrbarhiridaṃ varīya ā sīdata cakṛmā vaḥsyonam |
Translation: 8 On our wide grass, Three Goddesses be seated: for you have we prepared and made it pleasant.

Sanskit Text: मनुष्वद यज्ञं सुधिता हवींषीळा देवीघ्र्तपदी जुषन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manuṣvad yajñaṃ sudhitā havīṃṣīḷā devīghṛtapadī juṣanta ||
Translation: May Iḷā, she whose foot drops oil, the Goddess, taste, man-like, sacrifice and well-set presents.

Sanskit Text: देव तवष्टर्यद ध चारुत्वमानड यदङगिरसामभवः सचाभूः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: deva tvaṣṭaryad dha cārutvamānaḍ yadaṅghirasāmabhavaḥ sacābhūḥ |
Translation: 9 Since thou, God Tvaṣṭar, hast made beauty perfect, since hou hast been the Aṅgirases' Companion,

Sanskit Text: स देवानां पाथ उप पर विद्वानुशन यक्षि दरविणोदः सुरत्नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa devānāṃ pātha upa pra vidvānuśan yakṣi draviṇodaḥ suratnaḥ ||
Translation: Willing, most wealthy, Giver of possessions, grant us the Gods’ assembly, thou who knowest.

Sanskit Text: वनस्पते रशनया नियूया देवानां पाथ उप वक्षिविद्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanaspate raśanayā niyūyā devānāṃ pātha upa vakṣividvān |
Translation: 10 Well-knowing, binding with thy cord, bring hither, Lord of the Wood, the Deities' assembly.

Sanskit Text: सवदाति देवः कर्णवद धवींष्यवतान्द्यावाप्र्थिवी हवं मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svadāti devaḥ kṛṇavad dhavīṃṣyavatāndyāvāpṛthivī havaṃ me ||
Translation: The God prepare and season our oblations may Heaven and Earth be gracious to my calling.

Sanskit Text: आग्ने वह वरुणमिष्टये न इन्द्रं दिवो मरुतोन्तरिक्षात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āghne vaha varuṇamiṣṭaye na indraṃ divo marutoantarikṣāt |
Translation: 11 Agni, bring hither Varuṇa to help us, Indra from heaven, from air's mid-realm the Maruts.

Sanskit Text: सीदन्तु बर्हिर्विश्व आ यजत्राः सवाहादेवा अम्र्ता मादयन्ताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sīdantu barhirviśva ā yajatrāḥ svāhādevā amṛtā mādayantām ||
Translation: On sacred grass all Holy ones be seated and let the Immortal Gods rejoice in Svāhā.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पते परथमं वाचो अग्रं यत परैरत नामधेयन्दधानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspate prathamaṃ vāco aghraṃ yat prairata nāmadheyandadhānāḥ |
Translation: 1. WHEN-men, Bṛhaspati, giving names to objects, sent out Vāk's first and earliest utterances,

Sanskit Text: यदेषां शरेष्ठं यदरिप्रमासीत्प्रेणा तदेषां निहितं गुहाविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadeṣāṃ śreṣṭhaṃ yadaripramāsītpreṇā tadeṣāṃ nihitaṃ ghuhāviḥ ||
Translation: All that was excellent and spotless, treasured within them, was disclosed through their affection.

Sanskit Text: सक्तुमिव-तित-उना पुनन्तो यत्र धीरा मनसा वाचमक्रत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saktumiva-tita-unā punanto yatra dhīrā manasā vācamakrata |
Translation: 2 Where, like men cleansing corn-flour in a cribble, the wise in spirit have created language,

Sanskit Text: अत्रा सखायः सख्यानि जानते भद्रैषांलक्ष्मीर्निहिताधि वाचि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrā sakhāyaḥ sakhyāni jānate bhadraiṣāṃlakṣmīrnihitādhi vāci ||
Translation: Friends see and recognize the marks of friendship: their speech retains the blessed sign imprinted.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञेन वाचः पदवीयमायन तामन्वविन्दन्न्र्षिषुप्रविष्टाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñena vācaḥ padavīyamāyan tāmanvavindannṛṣiṣupraviṣṭām |
Translation: 3 With sacrifice the trace of Vāk they foIlowed, and found her harbouring within the Ṛṣis.

Sanskit Text: तामाभ्र्त्या वयदधुः पुरुत्रा तां सप्तरेभा अभि सं नवन्ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāmābhṛtyā vyadadhuḥ purutrā tāṃ saptarebhā abhi saṃ navante ||
Translation: They brought her, dealt her forth in many places: seven singers make her tones resound in concert.

Sanskit Text: उत तवः पश्यन न ददर्श वाचमुत तवः शर्ण्वन नश्र्णोत्येनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tvaḥ paśyan na dadarśa vācamuta tvaḥ śṛṇvan naśṛṇotyenām |
Translation: 4 One man hath ne’er seen Vāk, and yet he seeth: one man hath hearing but hath never heard her.

Sanskit Text: उतो तवस्मै तन्वं वि सस्रे जायेव पत्यौशती सुवासाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto tvasmai tanvaṃ vi sasre jāyeva patyauśatī suvāsāḥ ||
Translation: But to another hath she shown her beauty as a fond well-dressed woman to her husband.

Sanskit Text: उत तवं सख्ये सथिरपीतमाहुर्नैनं हिन्वन्त्यपिवाजिनेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta tvaṃ sakhye sthirapītamāhurnainaṃ hinvantyapivājineṣu |
Translation: 5 One man they call a laggard, dull in friendship: they never urge him on to deeds of valour.

Sanskit Text: अधेन्वा चरति माययैष वाचं शुश्रुवानफलामपुष्पाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhenvā carati māyayaiṣa vācaṃ śuśruvānaphalāmapuṣpām ||
Translation: He wanders on in profitless illusion: the Voice he heard yields neither fruit,nor blossom.

Sanskit Text: यस्तित्याज सचिविदं सखायं न तस्य वाच्यपि भागोस्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yastityāja sacividaṃ sakhāyaṃ na tasya vācyapi bhāghoasti |
Translation: 6 No part in Vāk hath he who hath abandoned his own dear friend who knows the truth of friendship.

Sanskit Text: यदीं शर्णोत्यलकं शर्णोति नहि परवेद सुक्र्तस्यपन्थाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadīṃ śṛṇotyalakaṃ śṛṇoti nahi praveda sukṛtasyapanthām ||
Translation: Even if he hears her still in vain he listens: naught knows he of the path of righteous action.

Sanskit Text: अक्षण्वन्तः कर्णवन्तः सखायो मनोजवेष्वसमाबभूवुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: akṣaṇvantaḥ karṇavantaḥ sakhāyo manojaveṣvasamābabhūvuḥ |
Translation: 7 Unequal in the quickness of their spirit are friends endowed alike with eyes and hearing.

Sanskit Text: आदघ्नास उपकक्षास उ तवे हरदा इव सनात्वा उत्वे दद्र्श्रे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādaghnāsa upakakṣāsa u tve hradā iva snātvā utve dadṛśre ||
Translation: Some look like tanks that reach the mouth or shoulder, others like pools of water fit to bathe in.

Sanskit Text: हर्दा तष्टेषु मनसो जवेषु यद बराह्मणाः संयजन्तेसखायः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hṛdā taṣṭeṣu manaso javeṣu yad brāhmaṇāḥ saṃyajantesakhāyaḥ |
Translation: 8 When friendly Brahmans sacrifice together with mental impulse which the heart hath fashioned,

Sanskit Text: अत्राह तवं वि जहुर्वेद्याभिरोहब्रह्माणो विचरन्त्यु तवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrāha tvaṃ vi jahurvedyābhirohabrahmāṇo vicarantyu tve ||
Translation: They leave one far behind through their attainments, and some who count as Brahmans wander elsewhere.

Sanskit Text: इमे ये नार्वां न परश्चरन्ति न बराह्मणासो नसुतेकरासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime ye nārvāṃ na paraścaranti na brāhmaṇāso nasutekarāsaḥ |
Translation: 9 Those men who step not back and move not forward, nor Brahmans nor preparers of libations,

Sanskit Text: त एते वाचमभिपद्य पापया सिरीस्तन्त्रं तन्वते अप्रजज्ञयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta ete vācamabhipadya pāpayā sirīstantraṃ tanvate aprajajñayaḥ ||
Translation: Having attained to Vāk in sinful fashion spin out their thread in ignorance like spinsters.

Sanskit Text: सर्वे नन्दन्ति यशसागतेन सभासाहेन सख्या सखायः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarve nandanti yaśasāghatena sabhāsāhena sakhyā sakhāyaḥ |
Translation: 10 All friends are joyful in the friend who cometh in triumph, having conquered in assembly.

Sanskit Text: किल्बिषस्प्र्त पितुषणिर्ह्येषामरं हितो भवतिवाजिनाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kilbiṣaspṛt pituṣaṇirhyeṣāmaraṃ hito bhavativājināya ||
Translation: He is their blame-averter, food-provider prepared is he and fit for deed of vigour.

Sanskit Text: रचां तवः पोषमास्ते पुपुष्वान गायत्रं तवो गायतिशक्वरीषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛcāṃ tvaḥ poṣamāste pupuṣvān ghāyatraṃ tvo ghāyatiśakvarīṣu |
Translation: 11 One plies his constant task reciting verses. one sings the holy psalm in Sakvari measures.

Sanskit Text: बरह्मा तवो वदति जातविद्यां यज्ञस्यमात्रां वि मिमीत उ तवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmā tvo vadati jātavidyāṃ yajñasyamātrāṃ vi mimīta u tvaḥ ||
Translation: One more, the Brahman, tells the lore of being, and one lays down the rules of sacrificing.

Sanskit Text: देवानां नु वयं जाना पर वोचाम विपन्यया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānāṃ nu vayaṃ jānā pra vocāma vipanyayā |
Translation: 1. LET US with tuneful skill proclaim these generations of the Gods,

Sanskit Text: उक्थेषुशस्यमानेषु यः पश्यादुत्तरे युगे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uktheṣuśasyamāneṣu yaḥ paśyāduttare yughe ||
Translation: That one may see them when these hymns are chanted in a future age.

Sanskit Text: बरह्मणस पतिरेता सं कर्मार इवाधमत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmaṇas patiretā saṃ karmāra ivādhamat |
Translation: 2 These Brahmaṇaspati produced with blast and smelting, like a Smith,

Sanskit Text: देवानाम्पूर्व्ये युगे.असतः सदजायत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānāmpūrvye yughe.asataḥ sadajāyata ||
Translation: Existence, in an earlier age of Gods, from Non-existence sprang.

Sanskit Text: देवानां युगे परथमे.असतः सदजायत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānāṃ yughe prathame.asataḥ sadajāyata |
Translation: 3 Existence, in the earliest age of Gods, from Non-existence sprang.

Sanskit Text: तदाशा अन्वजायन्त तदुत्तानपदस परि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadāśā anvajāyanta taduttānapadas pari ||
Translation: Thereafter were the regions born. This sprang from the Productive Power.

Sanskit Text: भूर्जज्ञ उत्तानपदो भुव आशा अजायन्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūrjajña uttānapado bhuva āśā ajāyanta |
Translation: 4 Earth sprang from the Productive Power the regions from the earth were born.

Sanskit Text: अदितेर्दक्षोजायत दक्षाद वदितिः परि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aditerdakṣoajāyata dakṣād vaditiḥ pari ||
Translation: Dakṣa was born of Aditi, and Aditi was Dakṣa's Child.

Sanskit Text: अदितिर्ह्यजनिष्ट दक्ष या दुहिता तव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aditirhyajaniṣṭa dakṣa yā duhitā tava |
Translation: 5 For Aditi, O Dakṣa, she who is thy Daughter, was brought forth.

Sanskit Text: तां देवान्वजायन्त भद्रा अम्र्तबन्धवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāṃ devāanvajāyanta bhadrā amṛtabandhavaḥ ||
Translation: After her were the blessed Gods born sharers of immortal life.

Sanskit Text: यद देवा अदः सलिले सुसंरब्धा अतिष्ठत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad devā adaḥ salile susaṃrabdhā atiṣṭhata |
Translation: 6 When ye, O Gods, in yonder deep closeclasping one another stood,

Sanskit Text: अत्रा वोन्र्त्यतामिव तीव्रो रेणुरपायत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrā vonṛtyatāmiva tīvro reṇurapāyata ||
Translation: Thence, as of dancers, from your feet a thickening cloud of dust arose.

Sanskit Text: यद देवा यतयो यथा भुवनान्यपिन्वत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad devā yatayo yathā bhuvanānyapinvata |
Translation: 7 When, O ye Gods, like Yatis, ye caused all existing things to grow,

Sanskit Text: अत्रा समुद्रा गूळमा सूर्यमजभर्तन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrā samudraā ghūḷamā sūryamajabhartana ||
Translation: Then ye brought Sūrya forward who was lying hidden in the sea.

Sanskit Text: अष्टौ पुत्रासो अदितेर्ये जातास्तन्वस परि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṣṭau putrāso aditerye jātāstanvas pari |
Translation: 8 Eight are the Sons of Adid who from her body sprang to life.

Sanskit Text: देवानुपप्रैत सप्तभिः परा मार्ताण्डमास्यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānupaprait saptabhiḥ parā mārtāṇḍamāsyat ||
Translation: With seven she went to meet the Gods she cast Martanda far away.

Sanskit Text: सप्तभिः पुत्रैरदितिरुप परैत पूर्व्यं युगम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saptabhiḥ putrairaditirupa prait pūrvyaṃ yugham |
Translation: 9 So with her Seven Sons Aditi went forth to meet the earlier age.

Sanskit Text: परजायै मर्त्यवे तवत पुनर्मार्ताण्डमाभरत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prajāyai mṛtyave tvat punarmārtāṇḍamābharat ||
Translation: She brought Martanda thitherward to spring to life and die again.

Sanskit Text: वसूनां वा चर्क्र्ष इयक्षन धिया वा यज्ञैर्वारोदस्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasūnāṃ vā carkṛṣa iyakṣan dhiyā vā yajñairvārodasyoḥ |
Translation: 1. I AM prepared to laud with song or worship the Noble Ones who are in earth and heaven,

Sanskit Text: अर्वन्तो वा ये रयिमन्तः सातौ वनुं वा येसुश्रुणं सुश्रुतो धुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvanto vā ye rayimantaḥ sātau vanuṃ vā yesuśruṇaṃ suśruto dhuḥ ||
Translation: Or Coursers who have triumphed in, the contest, or those who famed, have won the prize with glory.

Sanskit Text: हव एषामसुरो नक्षत दयां शरवस्यता मनसा निंसतक्षा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hava eṣāmasuro nakṣata dyāṃ śravasyatā manasā niṃsatakṣā |
Translation: 2 Their call, the call of Gods, went up to heaven: they kissed the ground with glory-seeking spirit,

Sanskit Text: चक्षाणा यत्र सुविताय देवा दयौर्न वारेभिःक्र्णवन्त सवैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakṣāṇā yatra suvitāya devā dyaurna vārebhiḥkṛṇavanta svaiḥ ||
Translation: There where the Gods look on for happy fortune, and like the kindly heavens bestow their bounties.

Sanskit Text: इयमेषामम्र्तानां गीः सर्वताता ये कर्पणन्त रत्नम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyameṣāmamṛtānāṃ ghīḥ sarvatātā ye kṛpaṇanta ratnam |
Translation: 3 This is the song of those Immortal Beings who long for treasures in their full perfection.

Sanskit Text: धियं च यज्ञं च साधन्तस्ते नो धान्तु वसव्यमसामि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhiyaṃ ca yajñaṃ ca sādhantaste no dhāntu vasavyamasāmi ||
Translation: May these, completing prayers and sacrifices, bestow upon us wealth where naught is wanting.

Sanskit Text: आ तत त इन्द्रायवः पनन्तभि य ऊर्वं गोमन्तन्तित्र्त्सान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tat ta indrāyavaḥ panantabhi ya ūrvaṃ ghomantantitṛtsān |
Translation: 4 Those living men extolled thy deed, O Indra, those who would fain burst through the stall of cattle,

Sanskit Text: सक्र्त्स्वं ये पुरुपुत्रां महीं सहस्रधाराम्ब्र्हतीं दुदुक्षन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakṛtsvaṃ ye puruputrāṃ mahīṃ sahasradhārāmbṛhatīṃ dudukṣan ||
Translation: Fain to milk her who bare but once, great, lofty, whose Sons are many and her streams past number.

Sanskit Text: शचीव इन्द्रमवसे कर्णुध्वमनानतं दमयन्तं पर्तन्यून |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śacīva indramavase kṛṇudhvamanānataṃ damayantaṃ pṛtanyūn |
Translation: 5 Sacivan, win to your assistance Indra who never bends, who overcomes his foemen.

Sanskit Text: रभुक्षणं मघवानं सुव्र्क्तिं भर्ता यो वज्रं नर्यम्पुरुक्षुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛbhukṣaṇaṃ maghavānaṃ suvṛktiṃ bhartā yo vajraṃ naryampurukṣuḥ ||
Translation: Ṛbhukṣan, Maghavan, the hymn's upholder, who, rich in food, bears man's kind friend, the thunder.

Sanskit Text: यद वावान पुरुतमं पुराषाळ आ वर्त्रहेन्द्रो नामान्यप्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vāvāna purutamaṃ purāṣāḷ ā vṛtrahendro nāmānyaprāḥ |
Translation: 6 Since he who won of old anew hath triumphed, Indra hath earned his name of Vṛtra-slaycr.

Sanskit Text: अचेति परासहस पतिस्तुविष्मान यदीमुश्मसिकर्तवे करत तत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aceti prāsahas patistuviṣmān yadīmuśmasikartave karat tat ||
Translation: He hath appeared, the mighty Lord of Conquest. What we would have him do let him accomplish.

Sanskit Text: पर सु व आपो महिमानमुत्तमं कारुर्वोचाति सदनेविवस्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra su va āpo mahimānamuttamaṃ kārurvocāti sadanevivasvataḥ |
Translation: 1. THE singer, O ye Waters in Vivasvān's place, shall tell your grandeur forth that is beyond compare.

Sanskit Text: पर सप्त-सप्त तरेधा हि चक्रमुः परस्र्त्वरीणामति सिन्धुरोजसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sapta-sapta tredhā hi cakramuḥ prasṛtvarīṇāmati sindhurojasā ||
Translation: The Rivers have come forward triply, seven and seven. Sindhu in might surpasses all the streams that flow.

Sanskit Text: पर ते.अरदद वरुणो यातवे पथः सिन्धो यद वाजानभ्यद्रवस्त्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te.aradad varuṇo yātave pathaḥ sindho yad vājānabhyadravastvam |
Translation: 2 Varuṇa cut the channels for thy forward course, O Sindhu, when thou rannest on to win the race.

Sanskit Text: भूम्या अधि परवता यासि सानुना यदेषामग्रं जगतामिरज्यसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūmyā adhi pravatā yāsi sānunā yadeṣāmaghraṃ jaghatāmirajyasi ||
Translation: Thou speedest o’er precipitous ridges of the earth, when thou art Lord and Leader of these moving floods.

Sanskit Text: दिवि सवनो यतते भूम्योपर्यनन्तं शुष्ममुदियर्तिभानुना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divi svano yatate bhūmyoparyanantaṃ śuṣmamudiyartibhānunā |
Translation: 3 His roar is lifted up to heaven above the earth: he puts forth endless vigour with a flash of light.

Sanskit Text: अभ्रादिव पर सतनयन्ति वर्ष्टयः सिन्धुर्यदेति वर्षभो न रोरुवत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhrādiva pra stanayanti vṛṣṭayaḥ sindhuryadeti vṛṣabho na roruvat ||
Translation: Like floods of rain that fall in thunder from the cloud, so Sindhu rushes on bellowing like a bull.

Sanskit Text: अभि तवा सिन्धो शिशुमिन न मातरो वाश्रा अर्षन्तिपयसेव धेनवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tvā sindho śiśumin na mātaro vāśrā arṣantipayaseva dhenavaḥ |
Translation: 4 Like mothers to their calves, like milch kine with their milk, so, Sindhu, unto thee the roaring rivers run.

Sanskit Text: राजेव युध्वा नयसि तवमित सिचौ यदासामग्रं परवतामिनक्षसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājeva yudhvā nayasi tvamit sicau yadāsāmaghraṃ pravatāminakṣasi ||
Translation: Thou leadest as a warrior king thine army's wings what time thou comest in the van of these swift streams.

Sanskit Text: इमं मे गङगे यमुने सरस्वति शुतुद्रि सतेमं सचता परुष्ण्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ me ghaṅghe yamune sarasvati śutudri stemaṃ sacatā paruṣṇyā |
Translation: 5 Favour ye this my laud, O Gan!gā, Yamunā, O Sutudri, Paruṣṇī and Sarasvatī:

Sanskit Text: असिक्न्या मरुद्व्र्धे वितस्तयार्जीकीये शर्णुह्यासुषोमया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asiknyā marudvṛdhe vitastayārjīkīye śṛṇuhyāsuṣomayā ||
Translation: With Asikni, Vitasta, O Marudvrdha, O Ārjīkīya with Susoma hear my call.

Sanskit Text: तर्ष्टामया परथमं यातवे सजूः ससर्त्वा रसयाश्वेत्या तया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tṛṣṭāmayā prathamaṃ yātave sajūḥ sasartvā rasayāśvetyā tyā |
Translation: 6 First with Trstama thou art eager to flow forth, with Rasā, and Susartu, and with Svetya here,

Sanskit Text: तवं सिन्धो कुभया गोमतीं करुमुम्मेहत्न्वा सरथं याभिरीयसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ sindho kubhayā ghomatīṃ krumummehatnvā sarathaṃ yābhirīyase ||
Translation: With Kubha; and with these, Sindhu and Mehatnu, thou seekest in thy course Krumu and Gomati.

Sanskit Text: रजीत्येनी रुशती महित्वा परि जरयांसि भरते रजांसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛjītyenī ruśatī mahitvā pari jrayāṃsi bharate rajāṃsi |
Translation: 7 Flashing and whitely-gleaming in her mightiness, she moves along her ample volumes through the realms,

Sanskit Text: अदब्धा सिन्धुरपसामपस्तमाश्वा न चित्रावपुषीव दर्शता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adabdhā sindhurapasāmapastamāśvā na citrāvapuṣīva darśatā ||
Translation: Most active of the active, Sindhu unrestrained, like to a dappled mare, beautiful, fair to see.

Sanskit Text: सवश्वा सिन्धुः सुरथा सुवासा हिरण्ययी सुक्र्तावाजिनीवती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svaśvā sindhuḥ surathā suvāsā hiraṇyayī sukṛtāvājinīvatī |
Translation: 8 Rich in good steeds is Sindhu, rich in cars and robes, rich in gold, nobly-fashioned, rich in ample wealth.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्णावती युवतिः सीलमावत्युताधि वस्तेसुभगा मधुव्र्धम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrṇāvatī yuvatiḥ sīlamāvatyutādhi vastesubhaghā madhuvṛdham ||
Translation: Blest Silamavati and young Urnavati invest themselves with raiment rich in store of sweets.

Sanskit Text: सुखं रथं युयुजे सिधुरश्विनं तेन वाजं सनिषदस्मिन्नाजौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sukhaṃ rathaṃ yuyuje sidhuraśvinaṃ tena vājaṃ saniṣadasminnājau |
Translation: 9 Sindhu hath yoked her car, light-rolling, drawn by steeds, and with that car shall she win booty in this fight.

Sanskit Text: महान हयस्य महिमा पनस्यते.अदब्धस्यस्वयशसो विरप्शिनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahān hyasya mahimā panasyate.adabdhasyasvayaśaso virapśinaḥ ||
Translation: So have I praised its power, mighty and unrestrained, of independent glory, roaring as it runs.

Sanskit Text: आ व रञ्जस ऊर्जां वयुष्टिष्विन्द्रं मरुतो रोदसीनक्तन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā va ṛñjasa ūrjāṃ vyuṣṭiṣvindraṃ maruto rodasīanaktana |
Translation: 1. I GRASP at you when power and strength begin to dawn: bedew ye, Indra and the Maruts, Heaven and Earth,

Sanskit Text: उभे यथा नो अहनी सचाभुवा सदः-सदोवरिवस्यात उद्भिदा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhe yathā no ahanī sacābhuvā sadaḥ-sadovarivasyāta udbhidā ||
Translation: That Day and Night, in every hall of sacrifice, may wait on us and bless us when they first spring forth.

Sanskit Text: तदु शरेष्ठं सवनं सुनोतनातयो न हस्तयतो अद्रिःसोतरि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadu śreṣṭhaṃ savanaṃ sunotanātyo na hastayato adriḥsotari |
Translation: 2 Press the libation out, most excellent of all: the Pressing-stone is grasped like a hand-guided steed.

Sanskit Text: विदद धयर्यो अभिभूति पौंस्यं महो राये चित्तरुते यदर्वतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidad dhyaryo abhibhūti pauṃsyaṃ maho rāye cittarute yadarvataḥ ||
Translation: So let it win the valour that subdues the foe, and the fleet courser's might that speeds to ample wealth.

Sanskit Text: तदिद धयस्य सवनं विवेरपो यथा पुरा मनवेगातुमश्रेत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadid dhyasya savanaṃ viverapo yathā purā manaveghātumaśret |
Translation: 3 Juice that this Stone pours out removes defect of ours, as in old time it brought prosperity to man.

Sanskit Text: गोर्णसि तवाष्ट्रे अश्वनिर्णिजि परेमध्वरेष्वध्वरानशिश्रयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghoarṇasi tvāṣṭre aśvanirṇiji premadhvareṣvadhvarānaśiśrayuḥ ||
Translation: At sacrifices they established holy rites on Tvaṣṭar's milk-blent juice bright with the hue of steeds.

Sanskit Text: अप हत रक्षसो भङगुरावत सकभायत निरतिंसेधतामतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa hata rakṣaso bhaṅghurāvata skabhāyata nirtiṃsedhatāmatim |
Translation: 4 Drive ye the treacherous demons far away from us: keep Nirrti afar and banish Penury.

Sanskit Text: आ नो रयिं सर्ववीरं सुनोतन देवाव्यम्भरत शलोकमद्रयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no rayiṃ sarvavīraṃ sunotana devāvyambharata ślokamadrayaḥ ||
Translation: Pour riches forth for us with troops of hero sons, and bear ye up, O Stones, the song that visits Gods.

Sanskit Text: दिवश्चिदा वो.अमवत्तरेभ्यो विभ्वना चिदाश्वपस्तरेभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divaścidā vo.amavattarebhyo vibhvanā cidāśvapastarebhyaḥ |
Translation: 5 To you who are more mighty than the heavens themselves, who, finishing your task with more than Vibhvan's speed,

Sanskit Text: वायोश्चिद सोमरभस्तरेभ्यो.अग्नेश्चिदर्चपितुक्र्त्तरेभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāyościda somarabhastarebhyo.aghneścidarcapitukṛttarebhyaḥ ||
Translation: More rapidly than Vāyu seize the Soma juice, better than Agni give us food, to you I sing.

Sanskit Text: भुरन्तु नो यशसः सोत्वन्धसो गरावाणो वाचा दिवितादिवित्मता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhurantu no yaśasaḥ sotvandhaso ghrāvāṇo vācā divitādivitmatā |
Translation: 6 Stirred be the glorious Stones: let it press out the juice, the Stone with heavenly song that reaches up to heaven,

Sanskit Text: नरो यत्र दुहते काम्यं मध्वाघोषयन्तोभितो मिथस्तुरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: naro yatra duhate kāmyaṃ madhvāghoṣayantoabhito mithasturaḥ ||
Translation: There where the men draw forth the meath for which they long, sending their voice around in rivalry of speed.

Sanskit Text: सुन्वन्ति सोमं रथिरासो अद्रयो निरस्य रसं गविषोदुहन्ति ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sunvanti somaṃ rathirāso adrayo nirasya rasaṃ ghaviṣoduhanti te |
Translation: 7 The Stones press out the Soma, swift as car-borne men, and, eager for the spoil, drain forth the sap thereof

Sanskit Text: दुहन्त्यूधरुपसेचनाय कं नरो हव्य नामर्जयन्त आसभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: duhantyūdharupasecanāya kaṃ naro havya nāmarjayanta āsabhiḥ ||
Translation: To fill the beaker, they exhaust the udder's store, as the men purify oblations with their lips.

Sanskit Text: एते नरः सवपसो अभूतन य इन्द्राय सुनुथ सोममद्रयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete naraḥ svapaso abhūtana ya indrāya sunutha somamadrayaḥ |
Translation: 8 Ye, present men, have been most skilful in your work, even ye, O Stones who pressed Soma for Indra's drink.

Sanskit Text: वामं-वामं वो दिव्याय धाम्ने वसु-वसु वः पार्थिवयसुन्वते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāmaṃ-vāmaṃ vo divyāya dhāmne vasu-vasu vaḥ pārthivayasunvate ||
Translation: May all ye have of fair go to the Heavenly Race, and all your treasure to the earthly worshipper.

Sanskit Text: अभ्रप्रुषो न वाचा परुषा वसु हविष्मन्तो न यज्ञाविजानुषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhrapruṣo na vācā pruṣā vasu haviṣmanto na yajñāvijānuṣaḥ |
Translation: 1. As with their voice from cloud they sprinkle treasure so are the wise man's liberal sacrifices.

Sanskit Text: सुमारुतं न बरह्माणमर्हसे गणमस्तोष्येषां न शोभसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sumārutaṃ na brahmāṇamarhase ghaṇamastoṣyeṣāṃ na śobhase ||
Translation: I praise their Company that merits worship as the good Martits' priest to pay them honour.

Sanskit Text: शरिये मर्यासो अञ्जीन्रक्र्ण्वत सुमरुतं न पूर्विरतिक्षपः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śriye maryāso añjīnrakṛṇvata sumarutaṃ na pūrviratikṣapaḥ |
Translation: 2 The youths have wrought their ornaments for glory through many nights,—this noble band of Maruts.

Sanskit Text: दिवस पुत्रास एता न येतिर आदित्यासस्ते अक्रन वाव्र्धुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divas putrāsa etā na yetira ādityāsaste akrana vāvṛdhuḥ ||
Translation: Like stags the Sons of Dyatis have striven onward, the Sons of Aditi grown strong like pillars.

Sanskit Text: पर ये दिवः पर्थिव्य न बर्हणा तमना रिरिच्रे अभ्रान्न सूर्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ye divaḥ pṛthivya na barhaṇā tmanā riricre abhrānna sūryaḥ |
Translation: 3 They who extend beyond the earth and heaven, by their own mass, as from the cloud spreads Sūrya;

Sanskit Text: पाजस्वन्तो न वीराः पनस्यवो रिशादसो नमर्या अभिद्यवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pājasvanto na vīrāḥ panasyavo riśādaso namaryā abhidyavaḥ ||
Translation: Like mighty Heroes covetous of glory, like heavenly gallants who destroy the wicked.

Sanskit Text: युष्माकं बुध्ने अपां न यामनि विथुर्यति न महीश्रथर्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmākaṃ budhne apāṃ na yāmani vithuryati na mahīśratharyati |
Translation: 4 When ye come nigh, as in the depth of waters, the earth is loosened, as it were, and shaken.

Sanskit Text: विश्वप्सुर्यज्ञो अर्वागयं सु वःप्रयस्वन्तो न सत्राच आ गत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvapsuryajño arvāghayaṃ su vaḥprayasvanto na satrāca ā ghata ||
Translation: This your all-feedin sacrifice approaches: come all united, fraught, as ’twere with viands.

Sanskit Text: यूयं धूर्षु परयुजो न रश्मिभिर्ज्योतिष्मन्तो न भासाव्युष्टिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyaṃ dhūrṣu prayujo na raśmibhirjyotiṣmanto na bhāsāvyuṣṭiṣu |
Translation: 5 Ye are like horses fastened to the chariot poles, luminous with your beams, with splendour as at dawn;

Sanskit Text: शयेनासो न सवयशसो रिशादसः परवासोन परसितासः परिप्रुषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śyenāso na svayaśaso riśādasaḥ pravāsona prasitāsaḥ paripruṣaḥ ||
Translation: Like self-bright falcons, punishers of wicked men, like hovering birds urged forward, scattering rain around.

Sanskit Text: पर यद वहध्वे मरुतः पराकाद यूयं महःसंवरणस्य वस्वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yad vahadhve marutaḥ parākād yūyaṃ mahaḥsaṃvaraṇasya vasvaḥ |
Translation: 6 When ye come forth, O Maruts, from the distance, from the great treasury of rich possessions,

Sanskit Text: विदानासो वसवो राध्यस्याराच्चिद्द्वेषः सनुतर्युयोत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidānāso vasavo rādhyasyārācciddveṣaḥ sanutaryuyota ||
Translation: Knowing, O Vasus, boons that should be granted, even from afar drive back the men who hate us.

Sanskit Text: य उद्र्चि यज्ञे अध्वरेष्ठा मरुद्भ्यो न मानुषो ददाशत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya udṛci yajñe adhvareṣṭhā marudbhyo na mānuṣo dadāśat |
Translation: 7 He who, engaged in the rite's final duty brings, as a man, oblation to the Maruts,

Sanskit Text: रेवत स वयो दधते सुवीरं स देवानामपि गोपीथेस्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: revat sa vayo dadhate suvīraṃ sa devānāmapi ghopītheastu ||
Translation: Wins him life's wealthy fulness, blest with heroes: he shall be present, too, where Gods drink Soma.

Sanskit Text: ते हि यज्ञेषु यज्ञियास ऊमा आदित्येन नाम्नाशम्भविष्ठाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te hi yajñeṣu yajñiyāsa ūmā ādityena nāmnāśambhaviṣṭhāḥ |
Translation: 8 For these are helps adored at sacrifices, bringing good fortune by their name Ādityas.

Sanskit Text: ते नो.अवन्तु रथतूर्मनीषां महश्चयामन्नध्वरे चकानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te no.avantu rathatūrmanīṣāṃ mahaścayāmannadhvare cakānāḥ ||
Translation: Speeding on cars let them protect our praises, delighting in our sacrifice and worship.

Sanskit Text: विप्रासो न मन्मभिः सवाध्यो देवाव्यो न यज्ञैःस्वप्नसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viprāso na manmabhiḥ svādhyo devāvyo na yajñaiḥsvapnasaḥ |
Translation: 1. Ye by your hymns are like high-thoughted singers, skilful, inviting Gods with sacrifices;

Sanskit Text: राजानो न चित्राः सुसन्द्र्शः कषितीनां नमर्या अरेपसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājāno na citrāḥ susandṛśaḥ kṣitīnāṃ namaryā arepasaḥ ||
Translation: Fair to behold, like Kings, with bright adornment, like spotless gallants, leaders of the people:

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्न ये भाजसा रुक्मवक्षसो वातासो न सवयुजःसद्यूतयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirna ye bhājasā rukmavakṣaso vātāso na svayujaḥsadyaūtayaḥ |
Translation: 2 Like fire with flashing flame, breast-bound with chains of gold, like tempest-blasts, self-moving, swift to lend your aid;

Sanskit Text: परज्ञातारो न जयेष्ठाः सुनीतयःसुशर्माणो न सोमा रतं यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prajñātāro na jyeṣṭhāḥ sunītayaḥsuśarmāṇo na somā ṛtaṃ yate ||
Translation: As best of all foreknowers, excellent to guide, like Somas, good to guard the man who follows Law.

Sanskit Text: वातासो न ये धुनयो जिगत्नवो.अग्नीनां न जिह्वाविरोकिणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vātāso na ye dhunayo jighatnavo.aghnīnāṃ na jihvāvirokiṇaḥ |
Translation: 3 Shakers of all, like gales of wind they travel, like tongues of burning fires in their effulgence.

Sanskit Text: वर्मण्वन्तो न योधाः शिमीवन्तः पितॄणांन शंसाः सुरातयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: varmaṇvanto na yodhāḥ śimīvantaḥ pitṝṇāṃna śaṃsāḥ surātayaḥ ||
Translation: Mighty are they as warriors clad in armour, and, like the Fathers' prayers, Most Bounteous Givers.

Sanskit Text: रथानां न ये.अराः सनाभयो जिगीवांसो न शूराभिद्यवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathānāṃ na ye.arāḥ sanābhayo jighīvāṃso na śūrāabhidyavaḥ |
Translation: 4 Like spokes of car-wheels in one nave united, ever victorious like heavenly Heroes,

Sanskit Text: वरेयवो न मर्या घर्तप्रुषो.अभिस्वर्तारोर्कं न सुष्टुभः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vareyavo na maryā ghṛtapruṣo.abhisvartāroarkaṃ na suṣṭubhaḥ ||
Translation: Shedding their precious balm like youthful suitors, they raise their voice and chant their psalm as singers.

Sanskit Text: अश्वासो न ये जयेष्ठास आशवो दिधिषवो न रथ्यःसुदानवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvāso na ye jyeṣṭhāsa āśavo didhiṣavo na rathyaḥsudānavaḥ |
Translation: 5 They who are fleet to travel like the noblest steeds, long to obtain the prize like bounteous charioteers,

Sanskit Text: आपो न निम्नैरुदभिर्जिगत्नवो विश्वरूपाङगिरसो न सामभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpo na nimnairudabhirjighatnavo viśvarūpāaṅghiraso na sāmabhiḥ ||
Translation: Like waters speeding on with their precipitous floods, like omniform Aṅgirases with Sāma-hymns.

Sanskit Text: गरावाणो न सूरयः सिन्धुमातर आदर्दिरासो अद्रयो नविश्वहा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghrāvāṇo na sūrayaḥ sindhumātara ādardirāso adrayo naviśvahā |
Translation: 6 Born from the stream, like press-stones are the Princes, for ever like the stones that crush in pieces;

Sanskit Text: शिशूला न करीळयः सुमातरो महाग्रामो नयामन्नुत तविषा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śiśūlā na krīḷayaḥ sumātaro mahāghrāmo nayāmannuta tviṣā ||
Translation: Sons of a beauteous Dame, like playful children, like a great host upon the march with splendour.

Sanskit Text: उषसां न केतवो.अध्वरश्रियः शुभंयवो नाञ्जिभिर्व्यश्वितन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣasāṃ na ketavo.adhvaraśriyaḥ śubhaṃyavo nāñjibhirvyaśvitan |
Translation: 7 Like rays of Dawn, the visitors of sacrifice, they shine with ornaments as eager to be bright.

Sanskit Text: सिन्धवो न ययियो भराजद्र्ष्टयः परावतो नयोजनानि ममिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sindhavo na yayiyo bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ parāvato nayojanāni mamire ||
Translation: Like rivers hasting on, glittering with their spears, from far away they measure out the distances.

Sanskit Text: सुभागान नो देवाः कर्णुता सुरत्नानस्मान सतोतॄन मरुतोवाव्र्धानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: subhāghān no devāḥ kṛṇutā suratnānasmān stotṝn marutovāvṛdhānāḥ |
Translation: 8 Gods, send us happiness and make us wealthy, letting us singers prosper, O ye Maruts.

Sanskit Text: अधि सतोत्रस्य सख्यस्य गात सनाद धि वोरत्नधेयानि सन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi stotrasya sakhyasya ghāta sanād dhi voratnadheyāni santi ||
Translation: Bethink you of our praise and of our friendship: ye from of old have riches to vouchsafe us.

Sanskit Text: अपश्यमस्य महतो महित्वममर्त्यस्य मर्त्यासु विक्षु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apaśyamasya mahato mahitvamamartyasya martyāsu vikṣu |
Translation: 1. I HAVE beheld the might of this Great Being. Immortal in the midst of tribes of mortals.

Sanskit Text: नाना हनू विभ्र्ते सं भरेते असिन्वती बप्सती भूर्यत्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nānā hanū vibhṛte saṃ bharete asinvatī bapsatī bhūryattaḥ ||
Translation: His jaws now open and now shut together: much they devour, insatiately chewing.

Sanskit Text: गुहा शिरो निहितं रधगक्षी असिन्वन्नत्ति जिह्वयावनानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghuhā śiro nihitaṃ ṛdhaghakṣī asinvannatti jihvayāvanāni |
Translation: 2 His eyes are turned away, his head is hidden: unsated with his tongue he eats the fuel.

Sanskit Text: अत्राण्यस्मै पड्भिः सं भरन्त्युत्तानहस्तानमसाधि विक्षु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrāṇyasmai paḍbhiḥ saṃ bharantyuttānahastānamasādhi vikṣu ||
Translation: With hands upraised, with reverence in the houses, for him they quickly bring his food together.

Sanskit Text: पर मातुः परतरं गुह्यमिछन कुमारो न वीरुधःसर्पदुर्वीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra mātuḥ prataraṃ ghuhyamichan kumāro na vīrudhaḥsarpadurvīḥ |
Translation: 3 Seeking, as ’twere, his Mother's secret bosom, he, like a child, creeps on through wide-spread bushes.

Sanskit Text: ससं न पक्वमविदच्छुचन्तंरिरिह्वांसं रिप उपस्थे अन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sasaṃ na pakvamavidacchucantaṃririhvāṃsaṃ ripa upasthe antaḥ ||
Translation: One he finds glowing like hot food made ready, and kissing deep within the earth's recmes.

Sanskit Text: तद वां रतं रोदसी पर बरवीमि जायमानो मातरा गर्भोत्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad vāṃ ṛtaṃ rodasī pra bravīmi jāyamāno mātarā gharbhoatti |
Translation: 4 This holy Law I tell you, Earth and Heaven: the Infant at his birth dovours his Parents.

Sanskit Text: नाहं देवस्य मर्त्यश्चिकेताग्निरङग विचेताः सप्रचेताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāhaṃ devasya martyaściketāghniraṅgha vicetāḥ sapracetāḥ ||
Translation: No knowledge of the God have I, a mortal. Yea, Agni knoweth best, for he hath wisdom.

Sanskit Text: यो अस्मा अन्नं तर्ष्वादधात्याज्यैर्घ्र्तैर्जुहोतिपुष्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo asmā annaṃ tṛṣvādadhātyājyairghṛtairjuhotipuṣyati |
Translation: 5 This man who quickly gives him food, who offers his gifts of oil and butter and supports him, -

Sanskit Text: तस्मै सहस्रमक्षभिर्वि चक्षे.अग्ने विश्वतःप्रत्यंं असि तवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmai sahasramakṣabhirvi cakṣe.aghne viśvataḥpratyaṃṃ asi tvam ||
Translation: Him with his thousand eyes he closely looks on: thou showest him thy face from all sides, Agni.

Sanskit Text: किं देवेषु तयज एनश्चकर्थाग्ने पर्छामि नु तवामविद्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kiṃ deveṣu tyaja enaścakarthāghne pṛchāmi nu tvāmavidvān |
Translation: 6 Agni, hast thou committed sin or treason among the Gods? In ignorance I ask thee.

Sanskit Text: अक्रीळन करीळन हरिरत्तवे.अदन वि पर्वशश्चकर्त गामिवासिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: akrīḷan krīḷan harirattave.adan vi parvaśaścakarta ghāmivāsiḥ ||
Translation: Playing, not playing, he gold-hued and toothless, hath cut his food up as the knife a victim.

Sanskit Text: विषूचो अश्वान युयुजे वनेजा रजीतिभी रशनाभिर्ग्र्भीतान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viṣūco aśvān yuyuje vanejā ṛjītibhī raśanābhirghṛbhītān |
Translation: 7 He born in wood hath yoked his horses rushing in all directions, held with reins that glitter.

Sanskit Text: चक्षदे मित्रो वसुभिः सुजातः समान्र्धेपर्वभिर्वाव्र्धानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakṣade mitro vasubhiḥ sujātaḥ samānṛdheparvabhirvāvṛdhānaḥ ||
Translation: The well-born friend hath carved his food with Vasus: in all his limbs he hath increased and prospered.

Sanskit Text: अग्निः सप्तिं वाजम्भरं ददात्यग्निर्वीरं शरुत्यंकर्मनिष्ठाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniḥ saptiṃ vājambharaṃ dadātyaghnirvīraṃ śrutyaṃkarmaniṣṭhām |
Translation: 1. AGNI bestows the fleet prize-winning courser: Agni, the hero famed and firm in duty.

Sanskit Text: अग्नी रोदसी वि चरत समञ्जन्नग्निर्नारीं वीरकुक्षिं पुरन्धिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnī rodasī vi carat samañjannaghnirnārīṃ vīrakukṣiṃ purandhim ||
Translation: Agni pervades and decks the earth and heaven, and fills the fruitful dame who teems with heroes.

Sanskit Text: अग्नेरप्नसः समिदस्तु भद्राग्निर्मही रोदसी आ विवेश |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnerapnasaḥ samidastu bhadrāghnirmahī rodasī ā viveśa |
Translation: 2 Blest be the wood that feeds the active Agni: within the two great worlds hath Agni entered.

Sanskit Text: अग्निरेकं चोदयत समत्स्वग्निर्व्र्त्राणि दयते पुरूणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirekaṃ codayat samatsvaghnirvṛtrāṇi dayate purūṇi ||
Translation: Agni impels a single man to battle, and with him rends in pieces many a foeman.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्ह तयं जरतः कर्णमावाग्निरद्भ्यो निरदहज्जरूथम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirha tyaṃ jarataḥ karṇamāvāghniradbhyo niradahajjarūtham |
Translation: 3 Agni rejoiced the car of him who praised lim, and from the waters burnt away jarutha.

Sanskit Text: अग्निरत्रिं घर्म उरुष्यदन्तरग्निर्न्र्मेधम्प्र जयास्र्जत सम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniratriṃ gharma uruṣyadantaraghnirnṛmedhampra jayāsṛjat sam ||
Translation: Agni saved Atri in the fiery cavem, and made Nrmedha rich with troops of children.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्दाद दरविणं वीरपेशा अग्निरषिं यः सहस्रासनोति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirdād draviṇaṃ vīrapeśā aghnirṣiṃ yaḥ sahasrāsanoti |
Translation: 4 Agni hath granted wealth that decks the hero, and sent the sage who wins a thousand cattle.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्दिवि हव्यमा ततानाग्नेर्धामानिविभ्र्ता पुरुत्रा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirdivi havyamā tatānāghnerdhāmānivibhṛtā purutrā ||
Translation: Agni hath made oblations rise to heaven: to every place are Agni's laws extended.

Sanskit Text: अग्निमुक्थैरषयो वि हवयन्ते.अग्निं नरो यामनिबाधितासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnimukthairṣayo vi hvayante.aghniṃ naro yāmanibādhitāsaḥ |
Translation: 5 With songs of praise the Ṛṣis call on Agni; on Agni, heroes worsted in the foray.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं वयो अन्तरिक्षे पतन्तो.अग्निः सहस्रापरि याति गोनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ vayo antarikṣe patanto.aghniḥ sahasrāpari yāti ghonām ||
Translation: Birds flying in the region call on Agni around a thousand cattle Agni wanders.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं विश ईळते मानुषीर्या अग्निं मनुषो नहुषो विजाताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ viśa īḷate mānuṣīryā aghniṃ manuṣo nahuṣo vijātāḥ |
Translation: 6 Races of human birth pay Agni worship, men who have sprung from Nahus' line adore him.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्गान्धर्वीं पथ्यां रतस्याग्नेर्गव्यूतिर्घ्र्त आ निषत्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirghāndharvīṃ pathyāṃ ṛtasyāghnerghavyūtirghṛta ā niṣattā ||
Translation: Stablished in holy oil is Agni's pasture, on the Gandharva path of Law and Order.

Sanskit Text: अग्नये बरह्म रभवस्ततक्षुरग्निं महामवोचामा सुव्र्क्तिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnaye brahma ṛbhavastatakṣuraghniṃ mahāmavocāmā suvṛktim |
Translation: 7 The Ṛbhus fabricated prayer for Agni, and we with mighty hymns have called on Agni.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने पराव जरितारं यविष्ठाग्ने महि दरविणमायजस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne prāva jaritāraṃ yaviṣṭhāghne mahi draviṇamāyajasva ||
Translation: Agni, Most Youthful God, protect the singer: win us by worship, Agni, great possessions.

Sanskit Text: य इमा विश्वा भुवनानि जुह्वद रषिर्होता नयसीदत्पिता नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya imā viśvā bhuvanāni juhvad ṛṣirhotā nyasīdatpitā naḥ |
Translation: 1. HE who sate down as Hotar-priest, the Ṛṣi, our Father, offering up all things existing,—

Sanskit Text: स आशिषा दरविणमिछमानः परथमछदवराना विवेश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa āśiṣā draviṇamichamānaḥ prathamachadavarānā viveśa ||
Translation: He, seeking through his wish a great possession, came among men on earth as archetypal.

Sanskit Text: किं सविदासीदधिष्ठनमारम्भणं कतमत सवित्कथासीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kiṃ svidāsīdadhiṣṭhanamārambhaṇaṃ katamat svitkathāsīt |
Translation: 2 What was the place whereon he took his station? What was it that supported him? How was it?

Sanskit Text: यतो भूमिं जनयन विश्वकर्म वि दयामौर्णोन महिना विश्वचक्षाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yato bhūmiṃ janayan viśvakarma vi dyāmaurṇon mahinā viśvacakṣāḥ ||
Translation: Whence Visvakarman, seeing all, producing the earth, with mighty power disclosed the heavens.

Sanskit Text: विश्वतश्चक्षुरुत विश्वतोमुखो विश्वतोबाहुरुतविश्वतस्पात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvataścakṣuruta viśvatomukho viśvatobāhurutaviśvataspāt |
Translation: 3 He who hath eyes on all sides round about him, a mouth on all sides, arms and feet on all sides,

Sanskit Text: सं बाहुभ्यां धमति सं पतत्रैर्द्यावाभूमी जनयन देव एकः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ bāhubhyāṃ dhamati saṃ patatrairdyāvābhūmī janayan deva ekaḥ ||
Translation: He, the Sole God, producing earth and heaven, weldeth them, with his arms as wings, together.

Sanskit Text: किं सविद वनं क उ स वर्क्ष आस यतो दयावाप्र्थिवीनिष्टतक्षुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kiṃ svid vanaṃ ka u sa vṛkṣa āsa yato dyāvāpṛthivīniṣṭatakṣuḥ |
Translation: 4 What was the tree, what wood in sooth produced it, from which they fashioned out the earth and heaven?

Sanskit Text: मनीषिणो मनसा पर्छतेदु तद यदध्यतिष्ठद भुवनानि धारयन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manīṣiṇo manasā pṛchatedu tad yadadhyatiṣṭhad bhuvanāni dhārayan ||
Translation: Ye thoughtful men inquire within your spirit whereon he stood when he established all things.

Sanskit Text: या ते धामानि परमाणि यावमा या मध्यमाविश्वकर्मन्नुतेमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā te dhāmāni paramāṇi yāvamā yā madhyamāviśvakarmannutemā |
Translation: 5 Nine highest, lowest, sacrificial natures, and these thy mid-most here, O Visvakarman,

Sanskit Text: शिक्षा सखिभ्यो हविषि सवधावःस्वयं यजस्व तन्वं वर्धानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śikṣā sakhibhyo haviṣi svadhāvaḥsvayaṃ yajasva tanvaṃ vṛdhānaḥ ||
Translation: Teach thou thy friends at sacrifice, O Blessed, and come thyself, exalted, to our worship.

Sanskit Text: विश्वकर्मन हविषा वाव्र्धानः सवयं यजस्व पर्थिवीमुत दयाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvakarman haviṣā vāvṛdhānaḥ svayaṃ yajasva pṛthivīmuta dyām |
Translation: 6 Bring thou thyself, exalted with oblation, O Visvakarman, Earth and Heaven to worship.

Sanskit Text: मुह्यन्त्वन्ये अभितो जनास इहास्माकं मघवासूरिरस्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: muhyantvanye abhito janāsa ihāsmākaṃ maghavāsūrirastu ||
Translation: Let other men around us live in folly here let us have a rich and liberal patron.

Sanskit Text: वाचस पतिं विश्वकर्माणमूतये मनोजुवं वाजे अद्याहुवेम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vācas patiṃ viśvakarmāṇamūtaye manojuvaṃ vāje adyāhuvema |
Translation: 7 Let us invoke to-day, to aid our labour, the Lord of Speech, the thought-swift Visvakarman.

Sanskit Text: स नो विश्वानि हवनानि जोषद विश्वशम्भूरवसेसाधुकर्मा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no viśvāni havanāni joṣad viśvaśambhūravasesādhukarmā ||
Translation: May he hear kindly all our invocations who gives all bliss for aid, whose works are righteous.

Sanskit Text: चक्षुषः पिता मनसा हि धीरो घर्तमेने अजनन्नन्नमाने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakṣuṣaḥ pitā manasā hi dhīro ghṛtamene ajanannannamāne |
Translation: 1. THE Father of the eye, the Wise in spirit, created both these worlds submerged in fatness.

Sanskit Text: यदेदन्ता अदद्र्हन्त पूर्व आदिद्द्यावाप्र्थिवी अप्रथेताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadedantā adadṛhanta pūrva ādiddyāvāpṛthivī aprathetām ||
Translation: Then when the eastern ends were firmly fastened, the heavens and the earth were far extended.

Sanskit Text: विश्वकर्मा विमना आद विहाया धाता विधाता परमोतसन्द्र्क |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvakarmā vimanā ād vihāyā dhātā vidhātā paramotasandṛk |
Translation: 2 Mighty in mind and power is Visvakarman, Maker, Disposer, and most lofty Presence.

Sanskit Text: तेषामिष्टानि समिषा मदन्ति यत्रासप्तर्षीन पर एकमाहुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: teṣāmiṣṭāni samiṣā madanti yatrāsaptaṛṣīn para ekamāhuḥ ||
Translation: Their offerings joy in rich juice where they value One, only One, beyond the Seven Ṛṣis.

Sanskit Text: यो नः पिता जनिता यो विधाता धामानि वेद भुवनानिविश्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo naḥ pitā janitā yo vidhātā dhāmāni veda bhuvanāniviśvā |
Translation: 3 Father who made us, he who, as Disposer, knoweth all races and all things existing,

Sanskit Text: यो देवानां नामधा एक एव तं सम्प्रश्नम्भुवना यन्त्यन्या ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo devānāṃ nāmadhā eka eva taṃ sampraśnambhuvanā yantyanyā ||
Translation: Even he alone, the Deities' narne-giver,him other beings seek for information.

Sanskit Text: त आयजन्त दरविणं समस्मा रषयः पूर्वे जरितारो नभूना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta āyajanta draviṇaṃ samasmā ṛṣayaḥ pūrve jaritāro nabhūnā |
Translation: 4 To him in sacrifice they offered treasures,—Ṛṣis of old, in numerous troops, as singers,

Sanskit Text: असूर्ते सूर्ते रजसि निषत्ते ये भूतानिसमक्र्ण्वन्निमानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asūrte sūrte rajasi niṣatte ye bhūtānisamakṛṇvannimāni ||
Translation: Who, in the distant, near, and lower region, made ready all these things that have existence.

Sanskit Text: परो दिवा पर एना पर्थिव्या परो देवेभिरसुरैर्यदस्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: paro divā para enā pṛthivyā paro devebhirasurairyadasti |
Translation: 5 That which is earlier than this earth and heaven, before the Asuras and Gods had being,—

Sanskit Text: कं सविद गर्भं परथमं दध्र आपो यत्र देवाःसमपश्यन्त विश्वे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaṃ svid gharbhaṃ prathamaṃ dadhra āpo yatra devāḥsamapaśyanta viśve ||
Translation: What was the germ primeval which the waters received where all the Gods were seen together?

Sanskit Text: तमिद गर्भं परथमं दध्र आपो यत्र देवाःसमगछन्त विश्वे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamid gharbhaṃ prathamaṃ dadhra āpo yatra devāḥsamaghachanta viśve |
Translation: 6 The waters, they received that germ primeval wherein the Gods were gathefed all together.

Sanskit Text: अजस्य नाभावध्येकमर्पितंयस्मिन विश्वानि भुवनानि तस्थुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajasya nābhāvadhyekamarpitaṃyasmin viśvāni bhuvanāni tasthuḥ ||
Translation: It rested set upon the Unborn's navel, that One wherein abide all things existing.

Sanskit Text: न तं विदाथ य इमा जजानायद युष्माकमन्तरम्बभूव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na taṃ vidātha ya imā jajānāyad yuṣmākamantarambabhūva |
Translation: 7 Ye will not find him who produced these creatures: another thing hath risen up among you.

Sanskit Text: नीहारेण पराव्र्ता जल्प्या चासुत्र्प उक्थशासश्चरन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nīhāreṇa prāvṛtā jalpyā cāsutṛpa ukthaśāsaścaranti ||
Translation: Enwrapt in misty cloud, with lips that stammer, hymn-chanters wander and are discontented.

Sanskit Text: यस्ते मन्यो.अविधद वज्र सायक सह ओजः पुष्यति विश्वमानुषक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaste manyo.avidhad vajra sāyaka saha ojaḥ puṣyati viśvamānuṣak |
Translation: 1. HE who hath reverenced thee, Manyu, destructive bolt, breeds for himself forthwith all conquering energy.

Sanskit Text: साह्याम दासमार्यं तवया युजा सहस्क्र्तेनसहसा सहस्वता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sāhyāma dāsamāryaṃ tvayā yujā sahaskṛtenasahasā sahasvatā ||
Translation: Ārya and Dāsa will we conquer with thine aid, with thee the Conqueror, with conquest conquest-sped.

Sanskit Text: मन्युरिन्द्रो मन्युरेवास देवो मन्युर्होता वरुणोजातवेदाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: manyurindro manyurevāsa devo manyurhotā varuṇojātavedāḥ |
Translation: 2 Manyu was Indra, yea, the God, was Manyu, Manyu was Hotar, Varuṇa, Jātavedas.

Sanskit Text: मन्युं विश ईळते मानुषीर्याः पाहि नोमन्यो तपसा सजोषाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manyuṃ viśa īḷate mānuṣīryāḥ pāhi nomanyo tapasā sajoṣāḥ ||
Translation: The tribes of human lineage worship Manyu. Accordant with thy fervour, Manyu, guard us.

Sanskit Text: अभीहि मन्यो तवसस्तवीयान तपसा युजा वि जहि शत्रून |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhīhi manyo tavasastavīyān tapasā yujā vi jahi śatrūn |
Translation: 3 Come hither, Manyu, mightier tham the mighty; chase, with thy fervour for ally, our foemen.

Sanskit Text: अमित्रहा वर्त्रहा दस्युहा च विश्वा वसून्या भरात्वं नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: amitrahā vṛtrahā dasyuhā ca viśvā vasūnyā bharātvaṃ naḥ ||
Translation: Slayer of foes, of Vṛtra, and of Dasyu, bring thou to us all kinds of wealth and treasure.

Sanskit Text: तवं हि मन्यो अभिभूत्योजाः सवयम्भूर्भामोभिमातिषाहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hi manyo abhibhūtyojāḥ svayambhūrbhāmoabhimātiṣāhaḥ |
Translation: 4 For thou art, Manyu, of surpassing vigour, fierce, queller of the foe, and self-existent,

Sanskit Text: विश्वचर्षणिः सहुरिः सहावानस्मास्वोजः पर्तनासु धेहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvacarṣaṇiḥ sahuriḥ sahāvānasmāsvojaḥ pṛtanāsu dhehi ||
Translation: Shared by all men, victorious, subduer: vouchsafe to us superior strengith in battles.

Sanskit Text: अभागः सन्नप परेतो अस्मि तव करत्वा तविषस्यप्रचेतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhāghaḥ sannapa pareto asmi tava kratvā taviṣasyapracetaḥ |
Translation: 5 I have departed, still without a portion, wise God! according to thy will, the Mighty.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा मन्यो अक्रतुर्जिहीळाहं सवा तनूर्बलदेयाय मेहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā manyo akraturjihīḷāhaṃ svā tanūrbaladeyāya mehi ||
Translation: I, feeble man, was wroth thee, O Manyu I am myself; come thou to give me vigour.

Sanskit Text: अयं ते अस्म्युप मेह्यर्वां परतीचीनः सहुरे विश्वधायः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ te asmyupa mehyarvāṃ pratīcīnaḥ sahure viśvadhāyaḥ |
Translation: 6 Come hither. I am all thine own; advancing turn thou to me, Victorious, All-supporter!

Sanskit Text: मन्यो वज्रिन्नभि मामा वव्र्त्स्व हनाव दस्यून्रुतबोध्यापेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manyo vajrinnabhi māmā vavṛtsva hanāva dasyūnrutabodhyāpeḥ ||
Translation: Come to me, Manyu, Wielder of the Thunder: bethink thee of thy friend, and slay the Dasyus.

Sanskit Text: अभि परेहि दक्षिणतो भवा मे.अधा वर्त्राणि जङघनावभूरि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi prehi dakṣiṇato bhavā me.adhā vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanāvabhūri |
Translation: 7 Approach, and on my right hand hold thy station: so shall we slay a multitude of foemen.

Sanskit Text: जुहोमि ते धरुणं मध्वो अग्रमुभा उपांशुप्रथमा पिबाव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: juhomi te dharuṇaṃ madhvo aghramubhā upāṃśuprathamā pibāva ||
Translation: The best of meath I offer to support thee: may we be first to drink thereof in quiet.

Sanskit Text: तवया मन्यो सरथमारुजन्तो हर्षमाणासो धर्षितामरुत्वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā manyo sarathamārujanto harṣamāṇāso dhṛṣitāmarutvaḥ |
Translation: 1. BORNE on with thee, O Manyu girt by Maruts, let our brave men, impetuous, bursting forward,

Sanskit Text: तिग्मेषव आयुधा संशिशाना अभि पर यन्तुनरो अग्निरूपाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tighmeṣava āyudhā saṃśiśānā abhi pra yantunaro aghnirūpāḥ ||
Translation: March on, like flames of fire in form, exulting, with pointed arrows, sharpening their weapons.

Sanskit Text: अग्निरिव मन्यो तविषितः सहस्व सेनानीर्नः सहुरे हूतेधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniriva manyo tviṣitaḥ sahasva senānīrnaḥ sahure hūtaedhi |
Translation: 2 Flashing like fire, be thou, O conquering Manyu, invoked, O Victor, as our army's leader.

Sanskit Text: हत्वाय शत्रून वि भजस्व वेद ओजो मिमानो वि मर्धोनुदस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hatvāya śatrūn vi bhajasva veda ojo mimāno vi mṛdhonudasva ||
Translation: Slay thou our foes, distribute their possessions: show forth thy vigour, scatter those who hate us.

Sanskit Text: सहस्व मन्यो अभिमातिमस्मे रुजन मर्णन परम्र्णन परेहिशत्रून |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasva manyo abhimātimasme rujan mṛṇan pramṛṇan prehiśatrūn |
Translation: 3 O Manyu, overcome thou our assailant on! breaking, slaying, crushing down the foemen.

Sanskit Text: उग्रं ते पाजो नन्वा रुरुध्रे वशी वशंनयस एकज तवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughraṃ te pājo nanvā rurudhre vaśī vaśaṃnayasa ekaja tvam ||
Translation: They have not hindered thine impetuous vigour: Mighty, Sole born! thou makest them thy subjects.

Sanskit Text: एको बहूनामसि मन्यवीळितो विशं-विशं युधये संशिशाधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eko bahūnāmasi manyavīḷito viśaṃ-viśaṃ yudhaye saṃśiśādhi |
Translation: 4 Alone or many thou art worshipped, Manyu: sharpen the spirit of each clan for battle.

Sanskit Text: अक्र्त्तरुक तवया युजा वयं दयुमन्तं घोषंविजयाय कर्ण्महे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: akṛttaruk tvayā yujā vayaṃ dyumantaṃ ghoṣaṃvijayāya kṛṇmahe ||
Translation: With thee to aid, O thou of perfect splendour, we will uplift the glorious shout for conquest.

Sanskit Text: विजेषक्र्दिन्द्र इवानवब्रवो.अस्माकं मन्यो अधिपा भवेह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vijeṣakṛdindra ivānavabravo.asmākaṃ manyo adhipā bhaveha |
Translation: 5 Unyielding bringing victory like Indra, O Manyu, be thou here our Sovran Ruler.

Sanskit Text: परियं ते नाम सहुरे गर्णीमसि विद्मा तमुत्सं यताबभूथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyaṃ te nāma sahure ghṛṇīmasi vidmā tamutsaṃ yataābabhūtha ||
Translation: To thy dear name, O Victor, we sing praises: we know the spring from which thou art come hither.

Sanskit Text: आभूत्या सहजा वज्र सायक सहो बिभर्ष्यभिभूतौत्तरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ābhūtyā sahajā vajra sāyaka saho bibharṣyabhibhūtauttaram |
