Translation: 6 Twin-born with power, destructive bolt of thunder, the highest conquering might is thine, Subduer!

Sanskit Text: करत्वा नो मन्यो सह मेद्येधि महाधनस्य पुरुहूतसंस्र्जि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratvā no manyo saha medyedhi mahādhanasya puruhūtasaṃsṛji ||
Translation: Be friendly to its in thy spirit, Manyu, O Much-invoked, in shock of mighty battle.

Sanskit Text: संस्र्ष्टं धनमुभयं समाक्र्तमस्मभ्यं दत्तांवरुणश्च मन्युः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃsṛṣṭaṃ dhanamubhayaṃ samākṛtamasmabhyaṃ dattāṃvaruṇaśca manyuḥ |
Translation: 7 For spoil let Varuṇa and Manyu give us the wealth of both sides gathered and collected;

Sanskit Text: भियं दधाना हर्दयेषु शत्रवःपराजितासो अप नि लयन्ताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhiyaṃ dadhānā hṛdayeṣu śatravaḥparājitāso apa ni layantām ||
Translation: And let our enemies with stricken spirits, o’erwhelmed with terror, slink away defeated.

Sanskit Text: रक्षोहणं वाजिनमा जिघर्मि मित्रं परथिष्ठमुपयामि शर्म |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rakṣohaṇaṃ vājinamā jigharmi mitraṃ prathiṣṭhamupayāmi śarma |
Translation: 1. I BALM with oil the mighty Rakṣas-slayer; to the most famous Friend I come for shelter

Sanskit Text: शिशानो अग्निः करतुभिः समिद्धः स नोदिवा स रिषः पातु नक्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śiśāno aghniḥ kratubhiḥ samiddhaḥ sa nodivā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam ||
Translation: Enkindled, sharpened by our rites, may Agni protect us in the day and night from evil.

Sanskit Text: अयोदंष्ट्रो अर्चिषा यातुधानानुप सप्र्श जातवेदःसमिद्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayodaṃṣṭro arciṣā yātudhānānupa spṛśa jātavedaḥsamiddhaḥ |
Translation: 2 O Jātavedas with the teeth of iron, enkindled with thy flame attack the demons.

Sanskit Text: आ जिह्वया मुरदेवान रभस्व करव्यादो वर्क्त्व्यपि धत्स्वासन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā jihvayā muradevān rabhasva kravyādo vṛktvyapi dhatsvāsan ||
Translation: Seize with thy longue the foolish gods' adorers: rend, put within thy mouth the raw-flesh caters.

Sanskit Text: उभोभयाविन्नुप धेहि दंष्ट्रा हिंस्रः शिशानो.अवरम्परं च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhobhayāvinnupa dhehi daṃṣṭrā hiṃsraḥ śiśāno.avaramparaṃ ca |
Translation: 3 Apply thy teeth, the upper and the lower, thou who hast both, enkindled and destroying.

Sanskit Text: उतान्तरिक्षे परि याहि राजञ जम्भैः सन्धेह्यभि यातुधानान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utāntarikṣe pari yāhi rājañ jambhaiḥ sandhehyabhi yātudhānān ||
Translation: Roam also in the air, O King, around us, and with thy jaws assail the wicked spirits.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञैरिषूः संनममानो अग्ने वाचा शल्यानशनिभिर्दिहानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñairiṣūḥ saṃnamamāno aghne vācā śalyānaśanibhirdihānaḥ |
Translation: 4 Bending thy shafts through sacrifices, Agni, whetting their points with song as if with whetstones,

Sanskit Text: ताभिर्विध्य हर्दये यातुधानान परतीचो बाहून्प्रति भंध्येषाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tābhirvidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān pratīco bāhūnprati bhaṃdhyeṣām ||
Translation: Pierce to the heart therewith the Yātudhānas, and break their arms uplifed to attack thee.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने तवचं यातुधानस्य भिन्धि हिंस्राशनिर्हरसाहन्त्वेनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne tvacaṃ yātudhānasya bhindhi hiṃsrāśanirharasāhantvenam |
Translation: 5 Pierce through the Yātudhāna's skin, O Agni; let the destroying dart with fire consume him.

Sanskit Text: पर पर्वाणि जातवेदः शर्णीहि करव्यात्क्रविष्णुर्वि चिनोतु वर्क्णम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra parvāṇi jātavedaḥ śṛṇīhi kravyātkraviṣṇurvi cinotu vṛkṇam ||
Translation: Rend his joints, Jātavedas, let the cater of flesh, flesh-seeking, track his mangled body.

Sanskit Text: यत्रेदानीं पश्यसि जातवेदस्तिष्ठन्तमग्न उत वाचरन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatredānīṃ paśyasi jātavedastiṣṭhantamaghna uta vācarantam |
Translation: 6 Where now thou seest Agni Jātavedas, one of these demons standing still or roaming,

Sanskit Text: यद वान्तरिक्षे पथिभिः पतन्तं तमस्ताविध्य शर्वा शिशानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vāntarikṣe pathibhiḥ patantaṃ tamastāvidhya śarvā śiśānaḥ ||
Translation: Or flying on those paths in air's midregion, sharpen the shaft and as an archer pierce him.

Sanskit Text: उतालब्धं सप्र्णुहि जातवेद आलेभानाद रष्टिभिर्यातुधानात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: utālabdhaṃ spṛṇuhi jātaveda ālebhānād ṛṣṭibhiryātudhānāt |
Translation: 7 Tear from the evil spirit, Jātavedas, what he hath seized and with his spears hath captured.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने पूर्वो नि जहि शोशुचान आमादःक्ष्विङकास्तमदन्त्वेनीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne pūrvo ni jahi śośucāna āmādaḥkṣviṅkāstamadantvenīḥ ||
Translation: Blazing before him strike him down, O Agni; let spotted carrion-eating kites devour him.

Sanskit Text: इह पर बरूहि यतमः सो अग्ने यो यातुधानो य इदंक्र्णोति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iha pra brūhi yatamaḥ so aghne yo yātudhāno ya idaṃkṛṇoti |
Translation: 8 Here tell this forth, O Agni: whosoever is, he himself, or acteth as, a demon,

Sanskit Text: तमा रभस्व समिधा यविष्ठ नर्चक्षसश्चक्षुषे रन्धयैनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamā rabhasva samidhā yaviṣṭha nṛcakṣasaścakṣuṣe randhayainam ||
Translation: Him grasp, O thou Most Youthful, with thy fuel. to the Mati-seer's eye give him as booty.

Sanskit Text: तीक्ष्णेनाग्ने चक्षुषा रक्ष यज्ञं पराञ्चं वसुभ्यःप्र णय परचेतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tīkṣṇenāghne cakṣuṣā rakṣa yajñaṃ prāñcaṃ vasubhyaḥpra ṇaya pracetaḥ |
Translation: 9 With keen glance guard the sacrifice, O Agni: thou Sage, conduct it onward to the Vasus.

Sanskit Text: हिंस्रं रक्षांस्यभि शोशुचानम्मा तवा दभन यातुधाना नर्चक्षः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiṃsraṃ rakṣāṃsyabhi śośucānammā tvā dabhan yātudhānā nṛcakṣaḥ ||
Translation: Let not the fiends, O Man-beholder, harm thee burning against the Rākṣasas to slay them.

Sanskit Text: नर्चक्षा रक्षः परि पश्य विक्षु तस्य तरीणि परतिश्र्णीह्यग्रा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛcakṣā rakṣaḥ pari paśya vikṣu tasya trīṇi pratiśṛṇīhyaghrā |
Translation: 10 Look on the fiend mid men, as Man-beholder: rend thou his three extremities in pieces.

Sanskit Text: तस्याग्ने पर्ष्टीर्हरसा शर्णीहि तरेधामूलं यातुधानस्य वर्श्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasyāghne pṛṣṭīrharasā śṛṇīhi tredhāmūlaṃ yātudhānasya vṛśca ||
Translation: Demolish with thy flame his ribs, O Agni, the Yātudhāna's root destroy thou triply.

Sanskit Text: तरिर्यातुधानः परसितिं त एत्व रतं यो अग्ने अन्र्तेन हन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: triryātudhānaḥ prasitiṃ ta etv ṛtaṃ yo aghne anṛtena hanti |
Translation: 11 Thrice, Agni, let thy noose surround the demon who with his falsehood injures Holy Order.

Sanskit Text: तमर्चिषा सफूर्जयञ जातवेदः समक्षमेनं गर्णतेनि वरंधि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamarciṣā sphūrjayañ jātavedaḥ samakṣamenaṃ ghṛṇateni vṛṃdhi ||
Translation: Loud roaring with thy flame, O Jātavedas, crush him and cast him down before the singer.

Sanskit Text: तदग्ने चक्षुः परति धेहि रेभे शफारुजं येनपश्यसि यातुधानम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadaghne cakṣuḥ prati dhehi rebhe śaphārujaṃ yenapaśyasi yātudhānam |
Translation: 12 Lead thou the worshipper that eye, O Agni, wherewith thou lookest on the hoof-armed demon.

Sanskit Text: अथर्ववज्ज्योतिषा दैव्येन सत्यन्धूर्वन्तमचितं नयोष ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atharvavajjyotiṣā daivyena satyandhūrvantamacitaṃ nyoṣa ||
Translation: With light celestial in Atharvan's manner burn up the foot who ruins truth with falsehood.

Sanskit Text: यदग्ने अद्य मिथुना शपातो यद वाचस्त्र्ष्टं जनयन्तरेभाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadaghne adya mithunā śapāto yad vācastṛṣṭaṃ janayantarebhāḥ |
Translation: 13 Agni, what curse the pair this day have uttered, what heated word the worshippers have spoken,

Sanskit Text: मन्योर्मनसः शरव्या जायते या तया विध्यह्र्दये यातुधानान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manyormanasaḥ śaravyā jāyate yā tayā vidhyahṛdaye yātudhānān ||
Translation: Each arrowy taunt sped from the angry spirit,—pierce to the heart therewith the Yātudhānas.

Sanskit Text: परा शर्णीहि तपसा यातुधानान पराग्ने रक्षो हरसाश्र्णीहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parā śṛṇīhi tapasā yātudhānān parāghne rakṣo harasāśṛṇīhi |
Translation: 14 With fervent heat exterminate the demons; destroy the fiends with burning flame, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: परार्चिषा मूरदेवाञ्छ्र्णीहि परासुत्र्पो अभिशोशुचानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parārciṣā mūradevāñchṛṇīhi parāsutṛpo abhiśośucānaḥ ||
Translation: Destroy with fire the foolish gods' adorers; blaze and destrepy the insatiable monsters.

Sanskit Text: पराद्य देवा वर्जिनं शर्णन्तु परत्यगेनं शपथा यन्तुत्र्ष्टाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parādya devā vṛjinaṃ śṛṇantu pratyaghenaṃ śapathā yantutṛṣṭāḥ |
Translation: 15 May Gods destroy this day the evil-doer may each hot curse of his return and blast him.

Sanskit Text: वाचास्तेनं शरव रछन्तु मर्मन विश्वस्यैतुप्रसितिं यातुधानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vācāstenaṃ śarava ṛchantu marman viśvasyaituprasitiṃ yātudhānaḥ ||
Translation: Let arrows pierce the liar in his vitals, and Visva's net enclose the Yātudhāna.

Sanskit Text: यः पौरुषेयेण करविषा समङकते यो अश्वेयेन पशुनायातुधानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ pauruṣeyeṇa kraviṣā samaṅkte yo aśveyena paśunāyātudhānaḥ |
Translation: 16 The fiend who smears himself with flesh of cattle, with flesh of horses and of human bodies,

Sanskit Text: यो अघ्न्याया भरति कषीरमग्ने तेषांशीर्षाणि हरसापि वर्श्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo aghnyāyā bharati kṣīramaghne teṣāṃśīrṣāṇi harasāpi vṛśca ||
Translation: Who steals the milch-cow's milk away, O Agni,—tear off the heads of such with fiery fury.

Sanskit Text: संवत्सरीणं पय उस्रियायास्तस्य माशीद यातुधानोन्र्चक्षः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃvatsarīṇaṃ paya usriyāyāstasya māśīd yātudhānonṛcakṣaḥ |
Translation: 17 The cow gives milk each year, O Man-regarder: let not the Yātudhāna ever taste it.

Sanskit Text: पीयूषमग्ने यतमस्तित्र्प्सात तं परत्यञ्चमर्चिषा विध्य मर्मन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pīyūṣamaghne yatamastitṛpsāt taṃ pratyañcamarciṣā vidhya marman ||
Translation: If one would glut him with the biesting, Agni, pierce with thy flame his vitals as he meets thee.

Sanskit Text: विषं गवां यातुधानाः पिबन्त्वा वर्श्च्यन्तामदितयेदुरेवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viṣaṃ ghavāṃ yātudhānāḥ pibantvā vṛścyantāmaditayedurevāḥ |
Translation: 18 Let the fiends drink the poison of the cattle; may Aditi cast off the evildoers.

Sanskit Text: परैनान देवः सविता ददातु परा भागमोषधीनां जयन्ताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parainān devaḥ savitā dadātu parā bhāghamoṣadhīnāṃ jayantām ||
Translation: May the God Savitar give them up to ruin, and be their share of plants and herbs denied them.

Sanskit Text: सनादग्ने मर्णसि यातुधानान न तवा रक्षांसि पर्तनासुजिग्युः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sanādaghne mṛṇasi yātudhānān na tvā rakṣāṃsi pṛtanāsujighyuḥ |
Translation: 19 Agni, from days of old thou slayest demons: never shall Rākṣasas in fight o’ercome thee.

Sanskit Text: अनु दह सहमूरान करव्यादो मा ते हेत्या मुक्षतदैव्यायाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anu daha sahamūrān kravyādo mā te hetyā mukṣatadaivyāyāḥ ||
Translation: Burn up the foolish ones, the flesh-devourers: let none of them escape thine heavenly arrow.

Sanskit Text: तवं नो अग्ने अधरादुदक्तात तवं पश्चादुत रक्षापुरस्तात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ no aghne adharādudaktāt tvaṃ paścāduta rakṣāpurastāt |
Translation: 20 Guard us, O Agni, from above and under, protect us fl-om behind us and before us;

Sanskit Text: परति ते ते अजरासस्तपिष्ठा अघशंसंशोशुचतो दहन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati te te ajarāsastapiṣṭhā aghaśaṃsaṃśośucato dahantu ||
Translation: And may thy flames, most fierce and never wasting, glowing with fervent heat, consume the sinner.

Sanskit Text: पश्चात पुरस्तादधरादुदक्तात कविः काव्येन परि पाहिराजन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: paścāt purastādadharādudaktāt kaviḥ kāvyena pari pāhirājan |
Translation: 21 From rear, from front, from under, from above us, O King, protect us as a Sage with wisdom.

Sanskit Text: सखे सखायमजरो जरिम्णे.अग्ने मर्तानमर्त्यस्त्वं नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sakhe sakhāyamajaro jarimṇe.aghne martānamartyastvaṃ naḥ ||
Translation: Guard to old age thy friend, O Friend, Eternal: O Agni, as Immortal, guard us mortals.

Sanskit Text: परि तवाग्ने पुरं वयं विप्रं सहस्य धीमहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari tvāghne puraṃ vayaṃ vipraṃ sahasya dhīmahi |
Translation: 22 We set thee round us as a fort, victorious Agni, thee a Sage,

Sanskit Text: धर्षद्वर्णं दिवे-दिवे हन्तारं भङगुरावताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhṛṣadvarṇaṃ dive-dive hantāraṃ bhaṅghurāvatām ||
Translation: Of hero lineage, day by day, destroyer of our treacherous foes.

Sanskit Text: विषेण भङगुरावतः परति षम रक्षसो दह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viṣeṇa bhaṅghurāvataḥ prati ṣma rakṣaso daha |
Translation: 23 Burn with thy poison turned against the treacherous brood of Rākṣasas,

Sanskit Text: अग्नेतिग्मेन शोचिषा तपुरग्राभिरषटिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnetighmena śociṣā tapuraghrābhirṣṭibhiḥ ||
Translation: O Agni, with thy sharpened glow, with lances armed with points of flame.

Sanskit Text: परत्यग्ने मिथुन दह यातुधाना किमीदिना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratyaghne mithuna daha yātudhānā kimīdinā |
Translation: 24 Burn thou the paired Kimīdins, brun, Agni, the Yātudhāna pairs.

Sanskit Text: सं तवाशिशामि जाब्र्ह्यदब्धं विप्र मन्मभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ tvāśiśāmi jābṛhyadabdhaṃ vipra manmabhiḥ ||
Translation: I sharpen thee, Infallible, with hymns. O Sage, be vigilant.

Sanskit Text: परत्यग्ने हरसा हरः शर्णीहि विश्वतः परति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratyaghne harasā haraḥ śṛṇīhi viśvataḥ prati |
Translation: 25 Shoot forth, O Agni, with thy flame demolish them on every side.

Sanskit Text: यातुधानस्य रक्षसो बलं वि रुज वीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yātudhānasya rakṣaso balaṃ vi ruja vīryam ||
Translation: Break thou the Yātudhāna's strength, the vigour of the Rākṣasa.

Sanskit Text: हविष पान्तमजरं सवर्विदि दिविस्प्र्श्याहुतं जुष्टमग्नौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: haviṣ pāntamajaraṃ svarvidi divispṛśyāhutaṃ juṣṭamaghnau |
Translation: 1. DEAR, ageless sacrificial drink is offered in light-discovering, heaven-pervading Agni.

Sanskit Text: तस्य भर्मणे भुवनाय देवा धर्मणे कंस्वधया पप्रथन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya bharmaṇe bhuvanāya devā dharmaṇe kaṃsvadhayā paprathanta ||
Translation: The Gods spread forth through his Celestial Nature, that he might bear the world up and sustain it.

Sanskit Text: गीर्णं भुवनं तमसपगूळमाविः सवरभवज्जातेग्नौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghīrṇaṃ bhuvanaṃ tamasapaghūḷamāviḥ svarabhavajjāteaghnau |
Translation: 2 The world was swallowed and concealed in darkness: Agni was born, and light became apparent.

Sanskit Text: तस्य देवाः पर्थिवि दयौरुतापो.अरणयन्नोषधीः सख्ये अस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya devāḥ pṛthivi dyaurutāpo.araṇayannoṣadhīḥ sakhye asya ||
Translation: The Deities, the broad earth, and the heavens, and plants, and waters gloried in his friendship.

Sanskit Text: देवेभिर्न्विषितो यज्ञियेभिरग्निं सतोषाण्यजरम्ब्र्हन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devebhirnviṣito yajñiyebhiraghniṃ stoṣāṇyajarambṛhantam |
Translation: 3 Inspired by Gods who claim our adoration, I now will laud Eternal Lofty Agni,

Sanskit Text: यो भानुना पर्थिविं दयामुतेमामाततानरोदसी अन्तरिक्षम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo bhānunā pṛthiviṃ dyāmutemāmātatānarodasī antarikṣam ||
Translation: Him who hath spread abroad the earth with lustre, this heaven, and both the worlds, and air's mid-region.

Sanskit Text: यो होतासीत परथमो देवजुष्टो यं समञ्जन्नाज्येनाव्र्णानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo hotāsīt prathamo devajuṣṭo yaṃ samañjannājyenāvṛṇānaḥ |
Translation: 4 Earliest Priest whom all the Gods accepted, and chose him, and anointed him with butter,

Sanskit Text: स पतत्रीत्वरं सथ जगद यच्छ्वात्रमग्निरक्र्नोज्जातवेदः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa patatrītvaraṃ stha jaghad yacchvātramaghnirakṛnojjātavedaḥ ||
Translation: He swiftly made all things that fly, stand, travel, all that hath motion, Agni Jātavedas.

Sanskit Text: यज्जतवेदो भुवनस्य मूर्धन्नतिष्ठो अग्ने सह रोचनेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajjatavedo bhuvanasya mūrdhannatiṣṭho aghne saha rocanena |
Translation: 5 Because thou, Agni, Jātavedas, stoodest at the world's head with thy refulgent splendour,

Sanskit Text: तं तवहेम मतिभिर्गीर्भिरुक्थैः स यज्ञियो अभवोरोदसिप्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvahema matibhirghīrbhirukthaiḥ sa yajñiyo abhavorodasiprāḥ ||
Translation: We sent thee forth with hymns and songs and praises: thou filledst heaven and earth, God meet for worship.

Sanskit Text: मूर्धा भुवो भवति नक्तमग्निस्ततः सुर्यो जायतेप्रातरुद्यन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mūrdhā bhuvo bhavati naktamaghnistataḥ suryo jāyateprātarudyan |
Translation: 6 Head of the world is Agni in the night-time; then, as the Sun, at morn springs up and rises.

Sanskit Text: मयामु तु यज्ञियानामेतमपो यत्तूर्णिश्चरति परजानन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mayāmu tu yajñiyānāmetamapo yattūrṇiścarati prajānan ||
Translation: Then to his task goes the prompt Priest foreknowing the wondrous power of Gods who must be honoured.

Sanskit Text: दर्शेन्यो यो महिना समिद्धो.अरोचत दिवियोनिर्विभावा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dṛśenyo yo mahinā samiddho.arocata diviyonirvibhāvā |
Translation: 7 Lovely is he who, kindled in his greatness, hath shone forth, seated in the heavens, refulgent.

Sanskit Text: तस्मिन्नग्नौ सूक्तवाकेन देवा हविर्विश्व अजुहवुस्तनूपाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasminnaghnau sūktavākena devā havirviśva ajuhavustanūpāḥ ||
Translation: With resonant hymns all Gods who guard our bodies have offered up oblation in this Agni.

Sanskit Text: सूक्तवकं परथममादिदग्निमादिद धविरजनयन्तदेवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūktavakaṃ prathamamādidaghnimādid dhavirajanayantadevāḥ |
Translation: 8 First the Gods brought the hymnal into being; then they engendered Agni, then oblation.

Sanskit Text: स एषां यज्ञो अभवत तनूपस्तं दयौर्वेदतं परिथिवि तमापः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa eṣāṃ yajño abhavat tanūpastaṃ dyaurvedataṃ prithivi tamāpaḥ ||
Translation: He was their sacrifice that guards our bodies: him the heavens know, the earth, the waters know him.

Sanskit Text: यं देवासो अजनयन्ताग्निं यस्मिन्नाजुहवुर्भुवनानिविश्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ devāso ajanayantāghniṃ yasminnājuhavurbhuvanāniviśvā |
Translation: 9 He, Agni, whom the Gods have generated, in whom they offered up all worlds and creatures,

Sanskit Text: सो अर्चिषा पर्थिवीं दयामुतेमां रजूयमानोतपन महित्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: so arciṣā pṛthivīṃ dyāmutemāṃ ṛjūyamānoatapan mahitvā ||
Translation: He with his bright glow heated earth and heaven, urging himself right onward in his grandeur.

Sanskit Text: सतोमेन हि दिवि देवासो अग्निमजीजनञ्छक्तिभीरोदसिप्राम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stomena hi divi devāso aghnimajījanañchaktibhīrodasiprām |
Translation: 10 Then by the laud the Gods engendered Agni in heaven, who fills both worlds through strength and vigour.

Sanskit Text: तमू अक्र्ण्वन तरेधा भुवे कं स ओषधीःपचति विश्वरूपाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamū akṛṇvan tredhā bhuve kaṃ sa oṣadhīḥpacati viśvarūpāḥ ||
Translation: They made him to appear in threefold essence: he ripens plants of every form and nature.

Sanskit Text: यदेदेनमदधुर्यज्ञियासो दिवि देवाः सूर्यमादितेयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadedenamadadhuryajñiyāso divi devāḥ sūryamāditeyam |
Translation: 11 What time the Gods, whose due is worship, set him as Sūrya, Son of Aditi, in heaven,

Sanskit Text: यदा चरिष्णू मिथुनावभूतामादित परापश्यन्भुवनानि विश्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā cariṣṇū mithunāvabhūtāmādit prāpaśyanbhuvanāni viśvā ||
Translation: When the Pair, ever wandering, sprang to being, all creatures that existed looked upon them.

Sanskit Text: विश्वस्मा अग्निं भुवनाय देवा वैश्वानरं केतुमह्नामक्र्ण्वन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvasmā aghniṃ bhuvanāya devā vaiśvānaraṃ ketumahnāmakṛṇvan |
Translation: 12 For all the world of life the Gods made Agni Vaiśvānara to be the days' bright Banner,—

Sanskit Text: आ यस्ततानोषसो विभातीरपो ऊर्णोति तमोर्चिषा यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yastatānoṣaso vibhātīrapo ūrṇoti tamoarciṣā yan ||
Translation: Him who hath spread abroad the radiant Mornings, and, coming with his light, unveils the darkness.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानरं कवयो यज्ञियासो.अग्निं देवा अजनयन्नजुर्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānaraṃ kavayo yajñiyāso.aghniṃ devā ajanayannajuryam |
Translation: 13 The wise and holy Deities engendered Agni Vaiśvānara whom age ne’er touches.

Sanskit Text: नक्षत्रं परत्नममिनच्चरिष्णु यक्षस्याध्यक्षन्तविषं बर्हन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nakṣatraṃ pratnamaminaccariṣṇu yakṣasyādhyakṣantaviṣaṃ bṛhantam ||
Translation: The Ancient Star that wanders on for ever, lofty and. strong, Lord of the Living Being.

Sanskit Text: वैश्वानरं विश्वहा दीदिवांसं मन्त्रैरग्निं कविमछा वदामः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vaiśvānaraṃ viśvahā dīdivāṃsaṃ mantrairaghniṃ kavimachā vadāmaḥ |
Translation: 14 We call upon the Sage with holy verses, Agni Vaiśvānara the ever-beaming,

Sanskit Text: यो महिम्ना परिबभूवोर्वी उतावस्तादुतदेवः परस्तात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo mahimnā paribabhūvorvī utāvastādutadevaḥ parastāt ||
Translation: Who hath surpassed both heaven and earth in greatness: he is a God below, a God above us.

Sanskit Text: दवे सरुती अश्र्णवं पितॄणामहं देवानामुतमर्त्यानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dve srutī aśṛṇavaṃ pitṝṇāmahaṃ devānāmutamartyānām |
Translation: 15 I have heard mention of two several pathways, ways of the Fathers and of Gods and mortals.

Sanskit Text: ताभ्यामिदं विश्वमेजत समेति यदन्तरापितरं मातरं च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tābhyāmidaṃ viśvamejat sameti yadantarāpitaraṃ mātaraṃ ca ||
Translation: On these two paths each moving creature travels, each thing between the Father and the Mother.

Sanskit Text: दवे समीची बिभ्र्तश्चरन्तं शीर्षतो जातं मनसाविम्र्ष्टम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dve samīcī bibhṛtaścarantaṃ śīrṣato jātaṃ manasāvimṛṣṭam |
Translation: 16 These two united paths bear him who journeys born from the head and pondered with the spirit

Sanskit Text: स परत्यं विश्वा भुवनानि तस्थावप्रयुछन्तरणिर्भ्राजमानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa pratyaṃ viśvā bhuvanāni tasthāvaprayuchantaraṇirbhrājamānaḥ ||
Translation: He stands directed to all things existing, hasting, unresting in his fiery splendour.

Sanskit Text: यत्रा वदेते अवरः परश्च यज्ञन्योः कतरो नौ वि वेद |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatrā vadete avaraḥ paraśca yajñanyoḥ kataro nau vi veda |
Translation: 17 Which of us twain knows where they speak together, upper and lower of the two rite-leaders?

Sanskit Text: आ शेकुरित सधमादं सखायो नक्षन्त यज्ञं कैदं वि वोचत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā śekurit sadhamādaṃ sakhāyo nakṣanta yajñaṃ kaidaṃ vi vocat ||
Translation: Our friends have helped to gather our assembly. They came to sacrifice; who will announce it?

Sanskit Text: कत्यग्नयः कति सूर्यासः कत्युषासः कत्यु सविदापः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: katyaghnayaḥ kati sūryāsaḥ katyuṣāsaḥ katyu svidāpaḥ |
Translation: 18 How many are the Fires and Suns in number? What is the number of the Dawns and Waters?

Sanskit Text: नोपस्पिजं वः पितरो वदामि पर्छामि वः कवयोविद्मने कम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nopaspijaṃ vaḥ pitaro vadāmi pṛchāmi vaḥ kavayovidmane kam ||
Translation: Not jestingly I speak to you, O Fathers. Sages, I ask you this for information.

Sanskit Text: यावन्मात्रमुषसो न परतीकं सुपर्ण्यो वसतेमातरिश्वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāvanmātramuṣaso na pratīkaṃ suparṇyo vasatemātariśvaḥ |
Translation: 19 As great as is the fair-winged Morning's presence to him who dwells beside us, Mātariśvan!

Sanskit Text: तावद दधात्युप यज्ञमायन बराह्मणोहोतुरवरो निषीदन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāvad dadhātyupa yajñamāyan brāhmaṇohoturavaro niṣīdan ||
Translation: Is what the Brahman does when he approaches to sacrifice and sits below the Hotar.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रशीर्षा पुरुषः सहस्राक्षः सहस्रपात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasraśīrṣā puruṣaḥ sahasrākṣaḥ sahasrapāt |
Translation: 1. A THOUSAND heads hath Puruṣa, a thousand eyes, a thousand feet.

Sanskit Text: सभूमिं विश्वतो वर्त्वात्यतिष्ठद दशाङगुलम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sabhūmiṃ viśvato vṛtvātyatiṣṭhad daśāṅghulam ||
Translation: On every side pervading earth he fills a space ten fingers wide.

Sanskit Text: पुरुष एवेदं सर्वं यद भूतं यच्च भव्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: puruṣa evedaṃ sarvaṃ yad bhūtaṃ yacca bhavyam |
Translation: 2 This Puruṣa is all that yet hath been and all that is to be;

Sanskit Text: उताम्र्तत्वस्येशानो यदन्नेनातिरोहति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utāmṛtatvasyeśāno yadannenātirohati ||
Translation: The Lord of Immortality which waxes greater still by food.

Sanskit Text: एतावानस्य महिमातो जयायांश्च पूरुषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etāvānasya mahimāto jyāyāṃśca pūruṣaḥ |
Translation: 3 So mighty is his greatness; yea, greater than this is Puruṣa.

Sanskit Text: पादो.अस्यविश्वा भूतानि तरिपादस्याम्र्तं दिवि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pādo.asyaviśvā bhūtāni tripādasyāmṛtaṃ divi ||
Translation: All creatures are one-fourth of him, three-fourths eternal life in heaven.

Sanskit Text: तरिपादूर्ध्व उदैत पुरुषः पादो.अस्येहाभवत पुनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tripādūrdhva udait puruṣaḥ pādo.asyehābhavat punaḥ |
Translation: 4 With three-fourths Puruṣa went up: one-fourth of him again was here.

Sanskit Text: ततो विष्वं वयक्रामत साशनानशने अभि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tato viṣvaṃ vyakrāmat sāśanānaśane abhi ||
Translation: Thence he strode out to every side over what cats not and what cats.

Sanskit Text: तस्माद विराळ अजायत विराजो अधि पूरुषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmād virāḷ ajāyata virājo adhi pūruṣaḥ |
Translation: 5 From him Virāj was born; again Puruṣa from Virāj was born.

Sanskit Text: स जातोत्यरिच्यत पश्चाद भूमिमथो पुरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa jātoatyaricyata paścād bhūmimatho puraḥ ||
Translation: As soon as he was born he spread eastward and westward o’er the earth.

Sanskit Text: यत पुरुषेण हविषा देवा यज्ञमतन्वत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat puruṣeṇa haviṣā devā yajñamatanvata |
Translation: 6 When Gods prepared the sacrifice with Puruṣa as their offering,

Sanskit Text: वसन्तोस्यासीदाज्यं गरीष्म इध्मः शरद धविः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasantoasyāsīdājyaṃ ghrīṣma idhmaḥ śarad dhaviḥ ||
Translation: Its oil was spring, the holy gift was autumn; summer was the wood.

Sanskit Text: तं यज्ञं बर्हिषि परौक्षन पुरुषं जातमग्रतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ yajñaṃ barhiṣi praukṣan puruṣaṃ jātamaghrataḥ |
Translation: 7 They balmed as victim on the grass Puruṣa born in earliest time.

Sanskit Text: तेन देवा अयजन्त साध्या रषयश्च ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tena devā ayajanta sādhyā ṛṣayaśca ye ||
Translation: With him the Deities and all Sādhyas and Ṛṣis sacrificed.

Sanskit Text: तस्माद यज्ञात सर्वहुतः सम्भ्र्तं पर्षदाज्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmād yajñāt sarvahutaḥ sambhṛtaṃ pṛṣadājyam |
Translation: 8 From that great general sacrifice the dripping fat was gathered up.

Sanskit Text: पशून्तांश्चक्रे वायव्यानारण्यान गराम्याश्च ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: paśūntāṃścakre vāyavyānāraṇyān ghrāmyāśca ye ||
Translation: He formed the creatures of-the air, and animals both wild and tame.

Sanskit Text: तस्माद यज्ञात सर्वहुत रचः सामानि जज्ञिरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmād yajñāt sarvahuta ṛcaḥ sāmāni jajñire |
Translation: 9 From that great general sacrifice Ṛcas and Sāma-hymns were born:

Sanskit Text: छन्दांसिजज्ञिरे तस्माद यजुस्तस्मादजायत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: chandāṃsijajñire tasmād yajustasmādajāyata ||
Translation: Therefrom were spells and charms produced; the Yajus had its birth from it.

Sanskit Text: तस्मादश्वा अजायन्त ये के चोभयादतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmādaśvā ajāyanta ye ke cobhayādataḥ |
Translation: 10 From it were horses born, from it all cattle with two rows of teeth:

Sanskit Text: गावो हजज्ञिरे तस्मात तस्माज्जाता अजावयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāvo hajajñire tasmāt tasmājjātā ajāvayaḥ ||
Translation: From it were generated kine, from it the goats and sheep were born.

Sanskit Text: यत पुरुषं वयदधुः कतिधा वयकल्पयन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat puruṣaṃ vyadadhuḥ katidhā vyakalpayan |
Translation: 11 When they divided Puruṣa how many portions did they make?

Sanskit Text: मुखं किमस्य कौ बाहू का ऊरू पादा उच्येते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mukhaṃ kimasya kau bāhū kā ūrū pādā ucyete ||
Translation: What do they call his mouth, his arms? What do they call his thighs and feet?

Sanskit Text: बराह्मणो.अस्य मुखमासीद बाहू राजन्यः कर्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: brāhmaṇo.asya mukhamāsīd bāhū rājanyaḥ kṛtaḥ |
Translation: 12 The Brahman was his mouth, of both his arms was the Rājanya made.

Sanskit Text: ऊरूतदस्य यद वैश्यः पद्भ्यां शूद्रो अजायत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrūtadasya yad vaiśyaḥ padbhyāṃ śūdro ajāyata ||
Translation: His thighs became the Vaiśya, from his feet the Śūdra was produced.

Sanskit Text: चन्द्रमा मनसो जातश्चक्षोः सूर्यो अजायत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: candramā manaso jātaścakṣoḥ sūryo ajāyata |
Translation: 13 The Moon was gendered from his mind, and from his eye the Sun had birth;

Sanskit Text: मुखादिन्द्रश्चाग्निश्च पराणाद वायुरजायत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mukhādindraścāghniśca prāṇād vāyurajāyata ||
Translation: Indra and Agni from his mouth were born, and Vāyu from his breath.

Sanskit Text: नाभ्या आसीदन्तरिक्षं शीर्ष्णो दयौः समवर्तत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nābhyā āsīdantarikṣaṃ śīrṣṇo dyauḥ samavartata |
Translation: 14 Forth from his navel came mid-air the sky was fashioned from his head

Sanskit Text: पद्भ्यां भूमिर्दिशः शरोत्रात तथा लोकानकल्पयन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: padbhyāṃ bhūmirdiśaḥ śrotrāt tathā lokānakalpayan ||
Translation: Earth from his feet, and from his car the regions. Thus they formed the worlds.

Sanskit Text: सप्तास्यासन परिधयस्त्रिः सप्त समिधः कर्ताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saptāsyāsan paridhayastriḥ sapta samidhaḥ kṛtāḥ |
Translation: 15 Seven fencing-sticks had he, thrice seven layers of fuel were prepared,

Sanskit Text: देवायद यज्ञं तन्वाना अबध्नन पुरुषं पशुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāyad yajñaṃ tanvānā abadhnan puruṣaṃ paśum ||
Translation: When the Gods, offering sacrifice, bound, as their victim, Puruṣa.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञेन यज्ञमयजन्त देवास्तानि धर्माणि परथमान्यासन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñena yajñamayajanta devāstāni dharmāṇi prathamānyāsan |
Translation: 16 Gods, sacrificing, sacrificed the victim these were the earliest holy ordinances.

Sanskit Text: ते ह नाकं महिमानः सचन्त यत्र पूर्वे साध्याःसन्ति देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te ha nākaṃ mahimānaḥ sacanta yatra pūrve sādhyāḥsanti devāḥ ||
Translation: The Mighty Ones attained the height of heaven, there where the Sādhyas, Gods of old, are dwelling.

Sanskit Text: सं जाग्र्वद्भिर्जरमाण इध्यते दमे दमूना इषयन्निळस पदे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ jāghṛvadbhirjaramāṇa idhyate dame damūnā iṣayanniḷas pade |
Translation: 1. BRISK, at the place of Iḷā, hymned by men who wake, our own familiar Friend is kindled in the house;

Sanskit Text: विश्वस्य होता हविषो वरेण्यो विभुर्विभावासुषखा सखीयते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvasya hotā haviṣo vareṇyo vibhurvibhāvāsuṣakhā sakhīyate ||
Translation: Hotar of all oblation, worthy of our choice, Lord, beaming, trusty friend to one who loveth him.

Sanskit Text: स दर्शतश्रीरतिथिर्ग्र्हे-गर्हे वने-वने शिश्रियेतक्ववीरिव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa darśataśrīratithirghṛhe-ghṛhe vane-vane śiśriyetakvavīriva |
Translation: 2 He, excellent in glory, guest in every house, finds like a swift-winged bird a home in every tree.

Sanskit Text: जनं-जनं जन्यो नाति मन्यते विश आक्षेति विश्यो विशं विशम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: janaṃ-janaṃ janyo nāti manyate viśa ākṣeti viśyo viśaṃ viśam ||
Translation: Benevolent to men, he scorns no living man: Friend to the tribes of men he dwells with every tribe.

Sanskit Text: सुदक्षो दक्षैः करतुनासि सुक्रतुरग्ने कविः काव्येनासिविश्ववित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sudakṣo dakṣaiḥ kratunāsi sukraturaghne kaviḥ kāvyenāsiviśvavit |
Translation: 3 Most sage with insight, passing skilful with thy powers art thou, O Agni, wise with wisdom, knowing all.

Sanskit Text: वसुर्वसूनां कषयसि तवमेक इद दयावा चयानि पर्थिवी च पुष्यतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasurvasūnāṃ kṣayasi tvameka id dyāvā cayāni pṛthivī ca puṣyataḥ ||
Translation: As Vasu, thou alone art Lord of all good things, of all the treasures that the heavens and earth produce.

Sanskit Text: परजानन्नग्ने तव योनिं रत्वियमिळायास पदे घर्तवन्तमासदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prajānannaghne tava yoniṃ ṛtviyamiḷāyās pade ghṛtavantamāsadaḥ |
Translation: 4 Foreknowing well, O Agni, thou in Iḷā's place hast occupied thy regular station balmed with oil.

Sanskit Text: आ ते चिकित्र उषसामिवेतयो.अरेपसः सूर्यस्येवरश्मयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā te cikitra uṣasāmivetayo.arepasaḥ sūryasyevaraśmayaḥ ||
Translation: Marked are thy comings like the comings of the Dawns, the rays of him who shineth spotless as the Sun.

Sanskit Text: तव शरियो वर्ष्यस्येव विद्युतश्चित्राश्चिकित्र उषसांन केतवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava śriyo varṣyasyeva vidyutaścitrāścikitra uṣasāṃna ketavaḥ |
Translation: 5 Thy glories are, as lightnings from the rainy cloud, marked, many-hued, like heralds of the Dawns’ approach,

Sanskit Text: यदोषधीरभिस्र्ष्टो वनानि च परिस्वयं चिनुषे अन्नमास्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadoṣadhīrabhisṛṣṭo vanāni ca parisvayaṃ cinuṣe annamāsye ||
Translation: When, loosed to wander over plants and forest trees, thou crammest by thyself thy food into thy mouth.

Sanskit Text: तमोषधीर्दधिरे गर्भं रत्वियं तमापो अग्निंजनयन्त मातरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamoṣadhīrdadhire gharbhaṃ ṛtviyaṃ tamāpo aghniṃjanayanta mātaraḥ |
Translation: 6 Him, duly coming as their germ, have plants received: this Agni have maternal Waters brought to life.

Sanskit Text: तमित समानं वनिनश्च वीरुधोऽनतर्वतीश्च सुवते च विश्वहा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamit samānaṃ vaninaśca vīrudho'ntarvatīśca suvate ca viśvahā ||
Translation: So in like manner do the forest trees and plants bear him within them and produce him evermore.

Sanskit Text: वातोपधूत इषितो वशाननु तर्षु यदन्ना वेविषद्वितिष्ठसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vātopadhūta iṣito vaśānanu tṛṣu yadannā veviṣadvitiṣṭhase |
Translation: 7 When, sped and urged by wind, thou spreadest thee abroad, swift piercing through thy food according to thy will,

Sanskit Text: आ ते यतन्ते रथ्यो यथा पर्थक छर्धांस्यग्ने अजराणि धक्षतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā te yatante rathyo yathā pṛthak chardhāṃsyaghne ajarāṇi dhakṣataḥ ||
Translation: Thy never-ceasing blazes, longing to consume, like men on chariots, Agni, strive on every side.

Sanskit Text: मेधाकारं विदथस्य परसाधनमग्निं होतारम्परिभूतमं मतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: medhākāraṃ vidathasya prasādhanamaghniṃ hotāramparibhūtamaṃ matim |
Translation: 8 Agni, the Hotar-priest who fills the assembly full, Waker of knowledge, chief Controller of the thought,—

Sanskit Text: तमिदर्भे हविष्या समानमित्तमिन महे वर्णते नान्यं तवत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamidarbhe haviṣyā samānamittamin mahe vṛṇate nānyaṃ tvat ||
Translation: Him, yea, none other than thyself, doth man elect at sacrificial offerings great and small alike.

Sanskit Text: तवामिदत्र वर्णते तवायवो होतारमग्ने विदथेषुवेधसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmidatra vṛṇate tvāyavo hotāramaghne vidatheṣuvedhasaḥ |
Translation: 9 Here, Agni, the arrangers, those attached to thee, elect thee as their Priest in sacred gatherings,

Sanskit Text: यद देवयन्तो दधति परयाण्सि ते हविष्मन्तोमनवो वर्क्तबर्हिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad devayanto dadhati prayāṇsi te haviṣmantomanavo vṛktabarhiṣaḥ ||
Translation: When men with strewn clipt grass and sacrificial gifts offer thee entertainment, piously inclined.

Sanskit Text: तवाग्ने होत्रं तव पोत्रं रत्वियं तव नेष्ट्रं तवमग्निद रतायतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tavāghne hotraṃ tava potraṃ ṛtviyaṃ tava neṣṭraṃ tvamaghnid ṛtāyataḥ |
Translation: 10 Thine is the Herald's task and Cleanser's duly timed; Leader art thou, and Kindler for the pious man.

Sanskit Text: तव परशास्त्रं तवमध्वरीयसि बरह्माचासि गर्हपतिश्च नो दमे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava praśāstraṃ tvamadhvarīyasi brahmācāsi ghṛhapatiśca no dame ||
Translation: Thou art Director, thou the ministering Priest: thou art the Brahman, Lord and Master in our home.

Sanskit Text: यस्तुभ्यमग्ने अम्र्ताय मर्त्यः समिधा दाशदुत वाहविष्क्र्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yastubhyamaghne amṛtāya martyaḥ samidhā dāśaduta vāhaviṣkṛti |
Translation: 11 When mortal man presents to thee Immortal God, Agni, his fuel or his sacrificial gift,

Sanskit Text: तस्य होता भवसि यासि दूत्यमुप बरूषेयजस्यध्वरीयसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya hotā bhavasi yāsi dūtyamupa brūṣeyajasyadhvarīyasi ||
Translation: Then thou art his Adhvaryu, Hotar, messenger, callest the Gods and orderest the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: इमा अस्मै मतयो वाचो अस्मदान रचो गिरः सुष्टुतयःसमग्मत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā asmai matayo vāco asmadān ṛco ghiraḥ suṣṭutayaḥsamaghmata |
Translation: 12 From us these hymns in concert have gone forth to him, these. holy words, these Ṛcas, songs and eulogies,

Sanskit Text: वसूयवो वसवे जातवेदसे वर्द्धासु चिद वर्धनोयासु चाकनत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasūyavo vasave jātavedase vṛddhāsu cid vardhanoyāsu cākanat ||
Translation: Eager for wealth, to Jātavedas fain for wealth: when they have waxen strong they please their Strengthener.

Sanskit Text: इमां परत्नाय सुष्टुतिं नवीयसीं वोचेयमस्मा उशतेश्र्णोतु नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imāṃ pratnāya suṣṭutiṃ navīyasīṃ voceyamasmā uśateśṛṇotu naḥ |
Translation: 13 This newest eulogy will I speak forth to him, the Ancient One who loves it. May he hear our voice.

Sanskit Text: भूया अन्तरा हर्द्यस्य निस्प्र्शे जायेवपत्य उशती सुवासाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūyā antarā hṛdyasya nispṛśe jāyevapatya uśatī suvāsāḥ ||
Translation: May it come near his heart and make it stir with love, as a fond well-dressed matron clings about her lord.

Sanskit Text: यस्मिन्नश्वास रषभास उक्षणो वशा मेषावस्र्ष्टास आहुताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasminnaśvāsa ṛṣabhāsa ukṣaṇo vaśā meṣāavasṛṣṭāsa āhutāḥ |
Translation: 14 He in whom horses, bulls, oxen, and barren cows, and rams, when duly set apart, are offered up,—

Sanskit Text: कीलालपे सोमप्र्ष्ठाय वेधसेह्र्दा मतिं जनये चारुमग्नये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kīlālape somapṛṣṭhāya vedhasehṛdā matiṃ janaye cārumaghnaye ||
Translation: To Agni, Soma-sprinkled, drinker of sweet juice, Disposer, with my heart I bring a fair hymn forth.

Sanskit Text: अहाव्यग्ने हविरास्ये ते सरुचीव घर्तं चम्वीव सोमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahāvyaghne havirāsye te srucīva ghṛtaṃ camvīva somaḥ |
Translation: 15 Into thy mouth is poured the offering, Agni, as Soma into cup, oil into ladle.

Sanskit Text: वाजसनिं रयिमस्मे सुवीरं परशस्तं धेहि यशसम्ब्र्हन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājasaniṃ rayimasme suvīraṃ praśastaṃ dhehi yaśasambṛhantam ||
Translation: Vouchsafe us wealth. strength-winning, blest with heroes, wealth lofty, praised by men, and full of splendour.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञस्य वो रथ्यं विश्पतिं विशां होतारमक्तोरतिथिं विभावसुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñasya vo rathyaṃ viśpatiṃ viśāṃ hotāramaktoratithiṃ vibhāvasum |
Translation: 1. I PRAISE your Charioteer of sacrifice, the Lord of men, Priest of the tribes, refulgent, Guest of night.

Sanskit Text: शोचञ्छुष्कासु हरिणीषु जर्भुरद्व्र्षा केतुर्यजतो दयामशायत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śocañchuṣkāsu hariṇīṣu jarbhuradvṛṣā keturyajato dyāmaśāyata ||
Translation: Blazing amid dry plants, snatching amid the green, the Strong, the Holy Herald hath attained to heaven.

Sanskit Text: इममञ्जस्पामुभये अक्र्ण्वत धर्माणमग्निं विदथस्यसाधनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imamañjaspāmubhaye akṛṇvata dharmāṇamaghniṃ vidathasyasādhanam |
Translation: 2 Him, Agni, Gods and men have made their chief support, who drinks the fatness and completes the sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: अक्तुं न यह्वमुषसः पुरोहितं तनूनपातमरुषस्य निंसते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aktuṃ na yahvamuṣasaḥ purohitaṃ tanūnapātamaruṣasya niṃsate ||
Translation: With kisses they caress the Grandson of the Red, like the swift ray of light, the Household Priest of Dawn.

Sanskit Text: बळ अस्य नीथा वि पणेश्च मन्महे वया अस्य परहुताासुरत्तवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: baḷ asya nīthā vi paṇeśca manmahe vayā asya prahutāāsurattave |
Translation: 3 Yea, we discriminate his and the niggard's ways: his branches evermore are sent forth to consume.

Sanskit Text: यदा घोरासो अम्र्तत्वमाशतादिज्जनस्यदैव्यस्य चर्किरन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā ghorāso amṛtatvamāśatādijjanasyadaivyasya carkiran ||
Translation: When his terrific flames have reached the Immortal's world, then men remember and extol the Heavenly Folk.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य हि परसितिर्द्यौरुरु वयचो नमो मह्यरमतिःपनीयसी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya hi prasitirdyaururu vyaco namo mahyaramatiḥpanīyasī |
Translation: 4 For then the net of Law, Dyaus, and the wide expanse, Earth, Worship, and Devotion meet for highest praise,

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो मित्रो वरुणः सं चिकित्रिरे.अथो भगःसविता पूतदक्षसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro mitro varuṇaḥ saṃ cikitrire.atho bhaghaḥsavitā pūtadakṣasaḥ ||
Translation: Varuṇa, Indra, Mitra were of one accord, and Savitar and Bhaga, Lords of holy might.

Sanskit Text: पर रुद्रेण ययिना यन्ति सिन्धवस्तिरो महीमरमतिन्दधन्विरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra rudreṇa yayinā yanti sindhavastiro mahīmaramatindadhanvire |
Translation: 5 Onward, with ever-roaming Rudra, speed the floods: over Aramati the Mighty have they run.

Sanskit Text: येभिः परिज्मा परियन्नुरु जरयो वि रोरुवज्जठरे विश्वमुक्षते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yebhiḥ parijmā pariyannuru jrayo vi roruvajjaṭhare viśvamukṣate ||
Translation: With them Parijman, moving round his vast domain, loud bellowing, bedews all things that are within.

Sanskit Text: कराणा रुद्रा मरुतो विश्वक्र्ष्टयो दिवः शयेनासोसुरस्य नीळयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: krāṇā rudrā maruto viśvakṛṣṭayo divaḥ śyenāsoasurasya nīḷayaḥ |
Translation: 6 Straightway the Rudras, Maruts visiting all men, Falcons of Dyaus, home-dwellers with the Asura,—

Sanskit Text: तेभिश्चष्टे वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमेन्द्रोदेवेभिरर्वशेभिरर्वशः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tebhiścaṣṭe varuṇo mitro aryamendrodevebhirarvaśebhirarvaśaḥ ||
Translation: Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman look on with these, and the swift-moving Indra with swift-moving Gods.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रे भुजं शशमानास आशत सूरो दर्शीके वर्षणश्च पौंस्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indre bhujaṃ śaśamānāsa āśata sūro dṛśīke vṛṣaṇaśca pauṃsye |
Translation: 7 With Indra have they found enjoyment, they who toil, in the light's beauty, in the very Strong One's strength;

Sanskit Text: पर ये नवस्यार्हणा ततक्षिरे युजं वज्रंन्र्षदनेषु कारवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ye nvasyārhaṇā tatakṣire yujaṃ vajraṃnṛṣadaneṣu kāravaḥ ||
Translation: The singers who in men's assemblies forged for him, according to his due, his friend the thunderbolt.

Sanskit Text: सूरश्चिदा हरितो अस्य रीरमदिन्द्रादा कश्चिद भयतेतवीयसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūraścidā harito asya rīramadindrādā kaścid bhayatetavīyasaḥ |
Translation: 8 Even the Sun's Bay Coursers hath lie held in check: each one fears Indra as the mightiest of all.

Sanskit Text: भीमस्य वर्ष्णो जठरादभिश्वसो दिवे-दिवेसहुरि सतन्नबाधितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhīmasya vṛṣṇo jaṭharādabhiśvaso dive-divesahuri stannabādhitaḥ ||
Translation: Unhindered, from the air's vault thunders day by day the loud triumphant breathing of the fearful Bull.

Sanskit Text: सतोमं वो अद्य रुद्राय शिक्वसे कषयद्वीराय नमसादिदिष्टन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stomaṃ vo adya rudrāya śikvase kṣayadvīrāya namasādidiṣṭana |
Translation: 9 With humble adoration show this day your song of praise to mighty Rudra, Ruler of the brave:

Sanskit Text: येभिः शिवः सववानेवयावभिर्दिवःसिषक्ति सवयशा निकामभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yebhiḥ śivaḥ svavānevayāvabhirdivaḥsiṣakti svayaśā nikāmabhiḥ ||
Translation: With whom, the Eager Ones, going their ordered course, he comes from heaven Self-bright, auspicious, strong to guard.

Sanskit Text: ते हि परजाया अभरन्त वि शरवो बर्हस्पतिर्व्र्षभःसोमजामयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te hi prajāyā abharanta vi śravo bṛhaspatirvṛṣabhaḥsomajāmayaḥ |
Translation: 10 For these have spread abroad the fame of human kind, the Bull Bṛhaspati and Soma's brotherhood.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञैरथर्वा परथमो वि धारयद देवादक्षैर्भ्र्गवः सं चिकित्रिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñairatharvā prathamo vi dhārayad devādakṣairbhṛghavaḥ saṃ cikitrire ||
Translation: Atharvan first by sacrifices made men sure: through skill the Bhṛgus were esteemed of all as Gods.

Sanskit Text: ते हि दयावाप्र्थिवी भूरिरेतसा नराशंसश्चतुरङगोयमो.अदितिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī bhūriretasā narāśaṃsaścaturaṅghoyamo.aditiḥ |
Translation: 11 For these, the Earth and Heaven with their abundant seed, four-bodied Narāśaṁsa, Yama, Aditi,

Sanskit Text: देवस्त्वष्टा दरविणोदा रभुक्षणः पररोदसी मरुतो विष्णुरर्हिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devastvaṣṭā draviṇodā ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ prarodasī maruto viṣṇurarhire ||
Translation: God Tvaṣṭar Wealth-bestower, the Ṛbhukṣaṇas, Rodasī, Maruts, Viṣṇu, claim and merit praise.

Sanskit Text: उत सय न उशिजामुर्विया कविरहिः शर्णोतु बुध्न्योहवीमनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta sya na uśijāmurviyā kavirahiḥ śṛṇotu budhnyohavīmani |
Translation: 12 And may he too give car, the Sage, from far away, the Dragon of the Deep, to this our yearning call.

Sanskit Text: सूर्यामासा विचरन्ता दिविक्षिता धियाशमीनहुषी अस्य बोधतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūryāmāsā vicarantā divikṣitā dhiyāśamīnahuṣī asya bodhatam ||
Translation: Ye Sun and Moon who dwell in heaven and move in turn, and with your thought, O Earth and Sky, observe this well.

Sanskit Text: पर नः पूषा चरथं विश्वदेव्यो.अपां नपादवतुवायुरिष्टये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra naḥ pūṣā carathaṃ viśvadevyo.apāṃ napādavatuvāyuriṣṭaye |
Translation: 13 Dear to all Gods, may Pūṣan guard the ways we go, the Waters’ child and Vāyu help us to success.

Sanskit Text: आत्मानं वस्यो अभि वातमर्चत तदश्विना सुहवा यामनि शरुतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ātmānaṃ vasyo abhi vātamarcata tadaśvinā suhavā yāmani śrutam ||
Translation: Sing lauds for your great bliss to Wind, the breath of all: ye Aśvins prompt to hear, hear this upon your way.

Sanskit Text: विशामासामभयानामधिक्षितं गीर्भिरु सवयशसंग्र्णीमसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśāmāsāmabhayānāmadhikṣitaṃ ghīrbhiru svayaśasaṃghṛṇīmasi |
Translation: 14 With hymns of praise we sing him who is throned as Lord over these fearless tribes, the Self-resplendent One.

Sanskit Text: गनाभिर्विश्वाभिरदितिमनर्वणमक्तोर्युवानं नर्मणा अधा पतिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghnābhirviśvābhiraditimanarvaṇamaktoryuvānaṃ nṛmaṇā adhā patim ||
Translation: We praise Night's youthful Lord benevolent to men, the foeless One, the free, with all celestial Dames.

Sanskit Text: रेभदत्र जनुषा पूर्वो अङगिरा गरावाण ऊर्ध्वा अभिचक्षुरध्वरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rebhadatra januṣā pūrvo aṅghirā ghrāvāṇa ūrdhvā abhicakṣuradhvaram |
Translation: 15 By reason of his birth here Aṅgiras first sang: the pressing-stones upraised beheld the sacrifice-

Sanskit Text: येभिर्विहाया अभवद विचक्षणःपाथः सुमेकं सवधितिर्वनन्वति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yebhirvihāyā abhavad vicakṣaṇaḥpāthaḥ sumekaṃ svadhitirvananvati ||
Translation: The stones through which the Sage became exceeding vast, and the sharp axe obtains in fight the beauteous place.

Sanskit Text: महि दयावाप्र्थिवी भूतमुर्वी नारी यह्वी न रोदसीसदं नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahi dyāvāpṛthivī bhūtamurvī nārī yahvī na rodasīsadaṃ naḥ |
Translation: 1. MIGHTY are ye, and far-extended, Heaven and Earth: both Worlds are evermore to us like two young Dames.

Sanskit Text: तेभिर्नः पातं सह्यस एभिर्नः पातंशूषणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tebhirnaḥ pātaṃ sahyasa ebhirnaḥ pātaṃśūṣaṇi ||
Translation: Guard us thereby from stronger foe; guard us hereby to give us strength.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञे-यज्ञे स मर्त्यो देवान सपर्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñe-yajñe sa martyo devān saparyati |
Translation: 2 In each succeeding sacrifice that mortal honoureth the Gods,

Sanskit Text: यः सुम्नैर्दीर्घश्रुत्तम आविवासत्येनान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ sumnairdīrghaśruttama āvivāsatyenān ||
Translation: He who, most widely known and famed for happiness, inviteth them.

Sanskit Text: विश्वेषामिरज्यवो देवानां वार्महः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśveṣāmirajyavo devānāṃ vārmahaḥ |
Translation: 3 Ye who are Rulers over all, great is your sovran power as Gods.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे हिविश्वमहसो विश्वे यज्ञेषु यज्ञियाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve hiviśvamahaso viśve yajñeṣu yajñiyāḥ ||
Translation: Ye all possess all majesty: all must be served in sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: ते घा राजानो अम्र्तस्य मन्द्रा अर्यमा मित्रो वरुणःपरिज्मा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te ghā rājāno amṛtasya mandrā aryamā mitro varuṇaḥparijmā |
Translation: 4 These are the joyous Kings of Immortality, Parijman, Mitra, Aryaman, and Varuṇa.

Sanskit Text: कद रुद्रो नर्णां सतुतो मरुतः पूषणो भगः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kad rudro nṛṇāṃ stuto marutaḥ pūṣaṇo bhaghaḥ ||
Translation: What else is Rudra, praised of men? the Maruts, Bhaga, Pūṣaṇa?

Sanskit Text: उत नो नक्तमपां वर्षण्वसू सूर्यामासा सदनायसधन्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta no naktamapāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū sūryāmāsā sadanāyasadhanyā |
Translation: 5 Come also to our dwelling, Lords of ample wealth, common partakers of our waters, Sun and Moon,

Sanskit Text: सचा यत साद्येषामहिर्बुध्नेषु बुध्न्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sacā yat sādyeṣāmahirbudhneṣu budhnyaḥ ||
Translation: When the great Dragon of the Deep hath settled down upon their floors.

Sanskit Text: उत नो देवावश्विना शुभस पती धामभिर्मित्रावरुणाुरुष्यताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta no devāvaśvinā śubhas patī dhāmabhirmitrāvaruṇāuruṣyatām |
Translation: 6 And let the Aśvins, Lords of splendour, set us free,—both Gods, and, with their Laws, Mitra and Varuṇa.

Sanskit Text: महः स राय एषते.अति धन्वेव दुरिता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahaḥ sa rāya eṣate.ati dhanveva duritā ||
Translation: Through woes, as over desert lands, he speeds to ample opulence.

Sanskit Text: उत नो रुद्रा चिन मर्ळतामश्विना विश्वे देवासो रथस्पतिर्भगः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta no rudrā cin mṛḷatāmaśvinā viśve devāso rathaspatirbhaghaḥ |
Translation: 7 Yea, let the Aśvins Twain he gracious unto us, even Rudras, and all Gods, Bhaga, Rathaspati;

Sanskit Text: रभुर्वाज रभुक्षणः परिज्मा विश्ववेदसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛbhurvāja ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ parijmā viśvavedasaḥ ||
Translation: Parijman, Ṛbhu, Vāja, O Lords of all wealth Ṛbhukṣaṇas.

Sanskit Text: रभुरभुक्षा रभुर्विधतो मद आ ते हरी जूजुवानस्यवाजिना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛbhurbhukṣā ṛbhurvidhato mada ā te harī jūjuvānasyavājinā |
Translation: 8 Prompt is Ṛbhukṣan, prompt the worshipper's strong drink: may thy fleet Bay Steeds, thine who speedest on, approach.

Sanskit Text: दुष्टरं यस्य साम चिद रधग यज्ञो नमानुषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: duṣṭaraṃ yasya sāma cid ṛdhagh yajño namānuṣaḥ ||
Translation: Not mans but God's is sacrifice whose psalm is unassailable.

Sanskit Text: कर्धी नो अह्रयो देव सवितः स च सतुषे मघोनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛdhī no ahrayo deva savitaḥ sa ca stuṣe maghonām |
Translation: 9 O God Savitar, harmed by none, lauded, give us a place among wealthy princes.

Sanskit Text: सहो नैन्द्रो वह्निभिर्न्येषां चर्षणीनां चक्रं रश्मिं नयोयुवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saho naindro vahnibhirnyeṣāṃ carṣaṇīnāṃ cakraṃ raśmiṃ nayoyuve ||
Translation: With his Car-steeds at once 'hath our Indra guided the reins and the car of these men.

Sanskit Text: ऐषु दयावाप्र्थिवी धातं महदस्मे वीरेषु विश्वचर्षणिश्रवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aiṣu dyāvāpṛthivī dhātaṃ mahadasme vīreṣu viśvacarṣaṇiśravaḥ |
Translation: 10 To these men present here, O Heaven and Earth, to us grant lofty fame extending over all mankind.

Sanskit Text: पर्क्षं वाजस्य सातये पर्क्षं रायोततुर्वणे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛkṣaṃ vājasya sātaye pṛkṣaṃ rāyotaturvaṇe ||
Translation: Give us a steed to win us strength, a steed with wealth for victory.

Sanskit Text: एतं शंसमिन्द्रास्मयुष टवं कूचित सन्तं सहसावन्नभिष्टये सदा पाह्यभिष्टये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etaṃ śaṃsamindrāsmayuṣ ṭvaṃ kūcit santaṃ sahasāvannabhiṣṭaye sadā pāhyabhiṣṭaye |
Translation: 11 This speaker, Indra—for thou art our Friend—wherever he may be, guard thou, Victor! for help, ever for help

Sanskit Text: मेदतां वेदता वसो ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: medatāṃ vedatā vaso ||
Translation: Thy wisdom, Vasu! prosper him.

Sanskit Text: एतं मे सतोमं तना न सूर्ये दयुतद्यामानं वाव्र्धन्तन्र्णाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etaṃ me stomaṃ tanā na sūrye dyutadyāmānaṃ vāvṛdhantanṛṇām |
Translation: 12 So have they strengthened this mine hymn which seems to take its bright path to the Sun, and reconciles the men:

Sanskit Text: संवननं नाश्व्यं तष्टेवानपच्युतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃvananaṃ nāśvyaṃ taṣṭevānapacyutam ||
Translation: Thus forms a carpenter the yoke of horses, not to be displaced.

Sanskit Text: वावर्त येषां राया युक्तैषां हिरण्ययी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāvarta yeṣāṃ rāyā yuktaiṣāṃ hiraṇyayī |
Translation: 13 Whose chariot-seat hath come again laden with wealth and bright with gold,

Sanskit Text: नेमधितान पौंस्या वर्थेव विष्टान्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nemadhitāna pauṃsyā vṛtheva viṣṭāntā ||
Translation: Lightly, with piercing ends, as ’twere two ranks of heroes ranged for fight.

Sanskit Text: पर तद दुःशीमे पर्थवाने वेने पर रामे वोचमसुरेमघवत्सु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra tad duḥśīme pṛthavāne vene pra rāme vocamasuremaghavatsu |
Translation: 14 This to Duḥśīma Pṛthavāna have I sung, to Vena, Rama, to the nobles, and the King.

Sanskit Text: ये युक्त्वाय पञ्च शतास्मयु पथा विश्राव्येषाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye yuktvāya pañca śatāsmayu pathā viśrāvyeṣām ||
Translation: They yoked five hundred, and their love of us was famed upon their way.

Sanskit Text: अधीन नवत्र सप्ततिं च सप्त च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhīn nvatra saptatiṃ ca sapta ca |
Translation: 15 Besides, they showed us seven-and-seventy horses here.

Sanskit Text: सद्यो दिदिष्ट तान्वःसद्यो दिदिष्ट पार्थ्यः सद्यो दिदिष्ट मायवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadyo didiṣṭa tānvaḥsadyo didiṣṭa pārthyaḥ sadyo didiṣṭa māyavaḥ ||
Translation: Tānva at once displayed his gift, Pārthya at once displayed his gift; and straightway Māyava showed his.

Sanskit Text: परैते वदन्तु पर वयं वदाम गरावभ्यो वाचं वदतावदद्भ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: praite vadantu pra vayaṃ vadāma ghrāvabhyo vācaṃ vadatāvadadbhyaḥ |
Translation: 1. LET these speak loudly forth; let us speak out aloud: to the loud speaking Pressing-stones address the speech;

Sanskit Text: यदद्रयः पर्वताः साकमाशवः शलोकंघोषं भरथेन्द्राय सोमिनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadadrayaḥ parvatāḥ sākamāśavaḥ ślokaṃghoṣaṃ bharathendrāya sominaḥ ||
Translation: When, rich with Soma juice, Stones of the mountain, ye, united, swift to Indra bring the sound of praise.

Sanskit Text: एते वदन्ति शतवत सहस्रवदभि करन्दन्ति हरितेभिरासभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete vadanti śatavat sahasravadabhi krandanti haritebhirāsabhiḥ |
Translation: 2 They speak out like a hundred, like a thousand men: they cry aloud to us with their green-tinted mouths,

Sanskit Text: विष्ट्वी गरावाणः सुक्र्तः सुक्र्त्यया होतुश्चित पूर्वे हविरद्यमाशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viṣṭvī ghrāvāṇaḥ sukṛtaḥ sukṛtyayā hotuścit pūrve haviradyamāśata ||
Translation: While, pious Stones, they ply their task with piety, and, even before the Hotar, taste the offered food.

Sanskit Text: एते वदन्त्यविदन्नना मधु नयूङखयन्ते अधि पक्वामिषि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ete vadantyavidannanā madhu nyūṅkhayante adhi pakvaāmiṣi |
Translation: 3 Loudly they speak, for they have found the savoury meath: they make a humming sound over the meat prepared.

Sanskit Text: वर्क्षस्य शाखामरुणस्य बप्सतस्ते सूभर्वाव्र्षभाः परेमराविषुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛkṣasya śākhāmaruṇasya bapsataste sūbharvāvṛṣabhāḥ premarāviṣuḥ ||
Translation: As they devour the branch of the Red-coloured Tree, these, the well-pastured Bulls, have uttered bellowings.

Sanskit Text: बर्हद वदन्ति मदिरेण मन्दिनेन्द्रं करोशन्तो.अविदन्ननामधु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhad vadanti madireṇa mandinendraṃ krośanto.avidannanāmadhu |
Translation: 4 They cry aloud, with strong exhilarating drink, calling on Indra now, for they have found the meath.

Sanskit Text: संरभ्या धीराः सवस्र्भिरनर्तिषुराघोषयन्तः पर्थिवीमुपब्दिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃrabhyā dhīrāḥ svasṛbhiranartiṣurāghoṣayantaḥ pṛthivīmupabdibhiḥ ||
Translation: Bold, with the sisters they have danced, embraced by them, making the earth reecho with their ringing sound.

Sanskit Text: सुपर्णा वाचमक्रतोप दयव्याखरे कर्ष्णा इषिरानर्तिषुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suparṇā vācamakratopa dyavyākhare kṛṣṇā iṣirāanartiṣuḥ |
Translation: 5 The Eagles have sent forth their cry aloft in heaven; in the sky's vault the dark impetuous ones have danced.

Sanskit Text: नयं नि यन्त्युपरस्य निष्क्र्तं पुरू रेतोदधिरे सूर्यश्वितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nyaṃ ni yantyuparasya niṣkṛtaṃ purū retodadhire sūryaśvitaḥ ||
Translation: Then downward to the nether stone's fixt place they sink, and, splendid as the Sun, effuse their copious stream.

Sanskit Text: उग्रा इव परवहन्तः समायमुः साकं युक्ता वर्षणोबिभ्रतो धुरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughrā iva pravahantaḥ samāyamuḥ sākaṃ yuktā vṛṣaṇobibhrato dhuraḥ |
Translation: 6 Like strong ones drawing, they have put forth all their strength: the Bulls, harnessed together, bear the chariot-poles.

Sanskit Text: यच्छ्वसन्तो जग्रसाना अराविषुःश्र्ण्व एषां परोथथो अर्वतामिव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yacchvasanto jaghrasānā arāviṣuḥśṛṇva eṣāṃ prothatho arvatāmiva ||
Translation: When they have bellowed, panting, swallowing their food, the sound of their loud snorting is like that of steeds.

Sanskit Text: दशावनिभ्यो दशकक्ष्येभ्यो दशयोक्त्रेभ्यो दशयोजनेभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśāvanibhyo daśakakṣyebhyo daśayoktrebhyo daśayojanebhyaḥ |
Translation: 7 To these who have ten workers and a tenfold girth, to these who have ten yoke-straps and ten binding thongs,

Sanskit Text: दशाभीशुभ्यो अर्चताजरेभ्यो दश धुरो दश युक्तावहद्भ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: daśābhīśubhyo arcatājarebhyo daśa dhuro daśa yuktāvahadbhyaḥ ||
Translation: To these who bear ten reins, the eternal, sing ye praise, to these who bear ten car-poles, ten when they are yoked.

Sanskit Text: ते अद्रयो दशयन्त्रास आशवस्तेषामाधानं पर्येतिहर्यतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te adrayo daśayantrāsa āśavasteṣāmādhānaṃ paryetiharyatam |
Translation: 8 These Stones with ten conductors, rapid in their course, with lovely revolution travel round and round.

Sanskit Text: त ऊ सुतस्य सोम्यस्यान्धसो.अंशोः पीयूषम्प्रथमस्य भेजिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta ū sutasya somyasyāndhaso.aṃśoḥ pīyūṣamprathamasya bhejire ||
Translation: They have been first to drink the flowing Soma juice, first to enjoy the milky fluid of the stalk.

Sanskit Text: ते सोमादो हरी इन्द्रस्य निंसते.अंशुं दुहन्तो अध्यासतेगवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te somādo harī indrasya niṃsate.aṃśuṃ duhanto adhyāsateghavi |
Translation: 9 These Soma-eaters kiss Indra's Bay-coloured Steeds: draining. the stalk they sit upon the ox's hide.

Sanskit Text: तेभिर्दुग्धं पपिवान सोम्यं मध्विन्द्रो वर्धतेप्रथते वर्षायते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tebhirdughdhaṃ papivān somyaṃ madhvindro vardhateprathate vṛṣāyate ||
Translation: Indra, when he hath drunk Soma-meath drawn by them, waxes in strength, is famed, is mighty as a Bull.

Sanskit Text: वर्षा वो अंशुर्न किला रिषाथनेलावन्तः सदमित्स्थनाशिताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣā vo aṃśurna kilā riṣāthanelāvantaḥ sadamitsthanāśitāḥ |
Translation: 10. Strong is your stalk; ye, verily, never shall be harmed; ye have refreshment, ye are ever satisfied.

Sanskit Text: रैवत्येव महसा चारव सथन यस्यग्रावाणो अजुषध्वमध्वरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: raivatyeva mahasā cārava sthana yasyaghrāvāṇo ajuṣadhvamadhvaram ||
Translation: Fair are ye, as it were, through splendour of his wealth, his in whose sacrifice, O Stones, ye find delight.

Sanskit Text: तर्दिला अत्र्दिलासो अद्रयो.अश्रमणा अश्र्थिता अम्र्त्यवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tṛdilā atṛdilāso adrayo.aśramaṇā aśṛthitā amṛtyavaḥ |
Translation: 11 Bored deep, but not pierced through with holes, are ye, O Stones, not loosened, never weary, and exempt from death,

Sanskit Text: अनातुरा अजरा सथामविष्णवः सुपीवसो अत्र्षितात्र्ष्णजः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anāturā ajarā sthāmaviṣṇavaḥ supīvaso atṛṣitāatṛṣṇajaḥ ||
Translation: Eternal, undiseased, moving in sundry ways, unthirsting, full of fatness, void of all desire.

Sanskit Text: धरुवा एव वः पितरो युगे-युगे कषेमकामासः सदसो नयुञ्जते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhruvā eva vaḥ pitaro yughe-yughe kṣemakāmāsaḥ sadaso nayuñjate |
Translation: 12 Your fathers, verily, stand firm from age to age: they, loving rest, are not dissevered from their seat.

Sanskit Text: अजुर्यासो हरिषाचो हरिद्रव आ दयां रवेणप्र्थिवीमशुश्रवुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajuryāso hariṣāco haridrava ā dyāṃ raveṇapṛthivīmaśuśravuḥ ||
Translation: Untouched by time, ne’er lacking green plants and green trees, they with their voice have caused the heavens and earth to hear.

Sanskit Text: तदिद वदन्त्यद्रयो विमोचने यामन्नञ्जस्पा इव घेदुपब्दिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadid vadantyadrayo vimocane yāmannañjaspā iva ghedupabdibhiḥ |
Translation: 13 This, this the Stones proclaim, what time they are disjoined, and when with ringing sounds they move and drink the balm.

Sanskit Text: वपन्तो बीजमिव धान्याक्र्तः पर्ञ्चन्तिसोमं न मिनन्ति बप्सतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vapanto bījamiva dhānyākṛtaḥ pṛñcantisomaṃ na minanti bapsataḥ ||
Translation: Like tillers of the ground when they are sowing seed, they mix the Soma, nor, devouring, minish it.

Sanskit Text: सुते अध्वरे अधि वाचमक्रता करीळयो न मातरन्तुदन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sute adhvare adhi vācamakratā krīḷayo na mātarantudantaḥ |
Translation: 14 They have raised high their voice for juice, for sacrifice, striking the Mother earth as though they danced thereon.

Sanskit Text: वि षू मुञ्चा सुषुवुषो मनीषां वि वर्तन्तामद्रयश्चायमानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi ṣū muñcā suṣuvuṣo manīṣāṃ vi vartantāmadrayaścāyamānāḥ ||
Translation: So loose thou too his thought who hath effused the sap, and let the Stones which we are honouring be disjoined.

Sanskit Text: हये जाये मनसा तिष्ठ घोरे वचांसि मिश्राक्र्णवावहै नु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: haye jāye manasā tiṣṭha ghore vacāṃsi miśrākṛṇavāvahai nu |
Translation: 1. Ho there, my consort! Stay, thou fierce-souled lady, and let us reason for a while together.

Sanskit Text: न नौ मन्त्रा अनुदितास एते मयस करन्परतरे चनाहन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na nau mantrā anuditāsa ete mayas karanparatare canāhan ||
Translation: Such thoughts as these of ours, while yet unspoken in days gone by have never brought us comfort.

Sanskit Text: किमेता वाचा कर्णवा तवाहं पराक्रमिषमुषसामग्रियेव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kimetā vācā kṛṇavā tavāhaṃ prākramiṣamuṣasāmaghriyeva |
Translation: 2 What am I now to do with this thy saying? I have gone from thee like the first of Mornings.

Sanskit Text: पुरूरवः पुनरस्तं परेहि दुरापना वातैवाहमस्मि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purūravaḥ punarastaṃ parehi durāpanā vātaivāhamasmi ||
Translation: Purūravas, return thou to thy dwelling: I, like the wind, am difficult to capture.

Sanskit Text: इषुर्न शरिय इषुधेरसना गोषाः शतसा न रंहिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣurna śriya iṣudherasanā ghoṣāḥ śatasā na raṃhiḥ |
Translation: 3 Like a shaft sent for glory from the quiver, or swift-steed winning cattle winning hundreds.

Sanskit Text: अवीरे करतौ वि दविद्युतन नोरा न मायुं चितयन्तधुनयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avīre kratau vi davidyutan norā na māyuṃ citayantadhunayaḥ ||
Translation: The lightning seemed to flash, as cowards planned it. The minstrels bleated like a lamb in trouble.

Sanskit Text: सा वसु दधती शवशुराय वय उषो यदि वष्ट्यन्तिग्र्हात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā vasu dadhatī śvaśurāya vaya uṣo yadi vaṣṭyantighṛhāt |
Translation: 4 Giving her husband's father life and riches, from the near dwelling, when her lover craved her,

Sanskit Text: अस्तं ननक्षे यस्मिञ्चाकन दिवा नक्तंश्नथिता वैतसेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: astaṃ nanakṣe yasmiñcākan divā naktaṃśnathitā vaitasena ||
Translation: She sought the home wherein she found her pleasure, accepting day and night her lord's embraces.

Sanskit Text: तरिः सम माह्नः शनथयो वैतसेनोत सम मे.अव्यत्यैप्र्णासि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: triḥ sma māhnaḥ śnathayo vaitasenota sma me.avyatyaipṛṇāsi |
Translation: 5 Thrice in the day didst thou embrace thy consort, though coldly she received thy fond caresses.

Sanskit Text: पुरूरवो.अनु ते केतमायं राजा मे वीर तन्वस्तदासीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purūravo.anu te ketamāyaṃ rājā me vīra tanvastadāsīḥ ||
Translation: To thy desires, Purūravas, I yielded: so wast thou king, O hero, of my body.

Sanskit Text: या सुजूर्णिः शरेणिः सुम्नापिर्ह्रदेचक्षुर्न गरन्थिनीचरण्युः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā sujūrṇiḥ śreṇiḥ sumnaāpirhradecakṣurna ghranthinīcaraṇyuḥ |
Translation: 6 The maids Sujirni, Sreni, Sumne-api, Charanyu, Granthini, and Hradecaksus,—

Sanskit Text: ता अञ्जयो.अरुणयो न सस्रुः शरिये गावो नधेनवो.अनवन्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā añjayo.aruṇayo na sasruḥ śriye ghāvo nadhenavo.anavanta ||
Translation: These like red kine have hastened forth, the bright ones, and like milch-cows have lowed in emulation.

Sanskit Text: समस्मिञ जायमान आसत गना उतेमवर्धन नद्यःस्वगूर्ताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samasmiñ jāyamāna āsata ghnā utemavardhan nadyaḥsvaghūrtāḥ |
Translation: 7 While he was born the Dames sate down together, the Rivers with free kindness gave him nurture;

Sanskit Text: महे यत तवा पुरूरवो रणायावर्धयन्दस्युहत्याय देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahe yat tvā purūravo raṇāyāvardhayandasyuhatyāya devāḥ ||
Translation: And then, Purūravas, the Gods increased thee for mighty battle, to destroy the Dasyus.

Sanskit Text: सचा यदासु जहतीष्वत्कममानुषीषु मानुषो निषेवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sacā yadāsu jahatīṣvatkamamānuṣīṣu mānuṣo niṣeve |
Translation: 8 When I, a mortal, wooed to mine embraces these heavenly nymphs who laid aside their raiment,

Sanskit Text: अप सम मत तरसन्ती न भुज्युस्ता अत्रसन रथस्प्र्शोनाश्वाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa sma mat tarasantī na bhujyustā atrasan rathaspṛśonāśvāḥ ||
Translation: Like a scared snake they fled from me in terror, like chariot horses when the car has touched them.

Sanskit Text: यदासु मर्तो अम्र्तासु निस्प्र्क सं कषोणीभिः करतुभिर्नप्र्ङकते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadāsu marto amṛtāsu nispṛk saṃ kṣoṇībhiḥ kratubhirnapṛṅkte |
Translation: 9 When, loving these Immortal Ones, the mortal hath converse with the nymphs as they allow him.

Sanskit Text: ता आतयो न तन्वः शुम्भत सवा अश्वासो नक्रीळयो दन्दशानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā ātayo na tanvaḥ śumbhata svā aśvāso nakrīḷayo dandaśānāḥ ||
Translation: Like swans they show the beauty of their bodies, like horses in their play they bite and nibble.

Sanskit Text: विद्युन न या पतन्ती दविद्योद भरन्ती मे अप्या काम्यानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidyun na yā patantī davidyod bharantī me apyā kāmyāni |
Translation: 10 She who flashed brilliant as the falling lightning brought me delicious presents from the waters.

Sanskit Text: जनिष्टो अपो नर्यः सुजातः परोर्वशी तिरत दीर्घमायुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: janiṣṭo apo naryaḥ sujātaḥ prorvaśī tirata dīrghamāyuḥ ||
Translation: Now from the flood be born a strong young hero May Uruvasi prolong her life for ever

Sanskit Text: जज्ञिष इत्था गोपीथ्याय हि दधाथ तत पुरूरवो मोजः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jajñiṣa itthā ghopīthyāya hi dadhātha tat purūravo maojaḥ |
Translation: 11 Thy birth hath made me drink from earthly milch-kine: this power, Purūravas, hast thou vouchsafed me.

Sanskit Text: अशासं तवा विदुषी सस्मिन्नहन न म आश्र्णोःकिमभुग वदासि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśāsaṃ tvā viduṣī sasminnahan na ma āśṛṇoḥkimabhugh vadāsi ||
Translation: I knew, and, warned thee, on that day. Thou wouldst not hear me. What sayest thou, when naught avails thee?

Sanskit Text: कदा सूनुः पितरं जात इछाच्चक्रन नाश्रु वर्तयद्विजानन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadā sūnuḥ pitaraṃ jāta ichāccakran nāśru vartayadvijānan |
Translation: 12 When will the son be born and seek his father? Mourner-like, will he weep when first he knows him?

Sanskit Text: को दम्पती समनसा वि यूयोदध यदग्निःश्वशुरेषु दीदयत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko dampatī samanasā vi yūyodadha yadaghniḥśvaśureṣu dīdayat ||
Translation: Who shall divide the accordant wife and husband, while fire is shining with thy consort's parents?

Sanskit Text: परति बरवाणि वर्तयते अश्रु चक्रन न करन्ददाध्येशिवायै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prati bravāṇi vartayate aśru cakran na krandadādhyeśivāyai |
Translation: 13 I will console him when his tears are falling: he shall not weep and cry for care that blesses.

Sanskit Text: पर तत ते हिनवा यत ते अस्मे परेह्यस्तं नहिमूर मापः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra tat te hinavā yat te asme parehyastaṃ nahimūra māpaḥ ||
Translation: That which is thine, between us, will I send thee. Go home again, thou fool;ṭhou hast not won me.

Sanskit Text: सुदेवो अद्य परपतेदनाव्र्त परावतं परमां गन्तवा उ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sudevo adya prapatedanāvṛt parāvataṃ paramāṃ ghantavā u |
Translation: 14 Thy lover shall flee forth this day for ever, to seek, without return, the farthest distance.

Sanskit Text: अधा शयीत निरतेरुपस्थे.अधैनं वर्का रभसासोद्युः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā śayīta nirterupasthe.adhainaṃ vṛkā rabhasāsoadyuḥ ||
Translation: Then let his bed be in Destruction's bosom, and there let fierce rapacious wolves devour him.

Sanskit Text: पुरूरवो मा मर्था मा पर पप्तो मा तवा वर्कासो अशिवास उक्षन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purūravo mā mṛthā mā pra papto mā tvā vṛkāso aśivāsa ukṣan |
Translation: 15 Nay, do not die, Purūravas, nor vanish: let not the evil-omened wolves devour thee.

Sanskit Text: न वै सत्रैणानि सख्यानि सन्ति सालाव्र्काणांह्र्दयान्येता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na vai straiṇāni sakhyāni santi sālāvṛkāṇāṃhṛdayānyetā ||
Translation: With women there can be no lasting friendship: hearts of hyenas are the hearts of women.

Sanskit Text: यद विरूपाचरं मर्त्येष्ववसं रात्रीः शरदश्चतस्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad virūpācaraṃ martyeṣvavasaṃ rātrīḥ śaradaścatasraḥ |
Translation: 16 When amid men in altered shape I sojourned, and through four autumns spent the nights among them,

Sanskit Text: घर्तस्य सतोकं सक्र्दह्न आश्नां तादेवेदन्तात्र्पाणा चरामि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtasya stokaṃ sakṛdahna āśnāṃ tādevedantātṛpāṇā carāmi ||
Translation: I tasted once a day a drop of butter; and even now with that am I am contented.

Sanskit Text: अन्तरिक्षप्रां रजसो विमानीमुप शिक्षाम्युर्वशींवसिष्ठः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: antarikṣaprāṃ rajaso vimānīmupa śikṣāmyurvaśīṃvasiṣṭhaḥ |
Translation: 17 I, her best love, call Urvasi to meet me, her who fills air and measures out the region.

Sanskit Text: उप तवा रातिः सुक्र्तस्य तिष्ठान नि वर्तस्वह्र्दयं तप्यते मे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa tvā rātiḥ sukṛtasya tiṣṭhān ni vartasvahṛdayaṃ tapyate me ||
Translation: Let the gift brought by piety approach thee. Turn thou to me again: my heart is troubled.

Sanskit Text: इति तवा देवा इम आहुरैळ यथेमेतद भवसिम्र्त्युबन्धुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iti tvā devā ima āhuraiḷa yathemetad bhavasimṛtyubandhuḥ |
Translation: 18 Thus speak these Gods to thee, O son of Iḷā: As death hath verily got thee for his subject,

Sanskit Text: परजा ते देवान हविषा यजाति सवर्ग उ तवमपि मादयासे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prajā te devān haviṣā yajāti svargha u tvamapi mādayāse ||
Translation: Thy sons shall serve the Gods with their oblation, and thou, moreover, shalt rejoice in Svarga.

Sanskit Text: पर ते महे विदथे शंसिषं हरी पर ते वन्वे वनुषोहर्यतं मदम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te mahe vidathe śaṃsiṣaṃ harī pra te vanve vanuṣoharyataṃ madam |
Translation: 1 In the great synod will I laud thy two Bay Steeds: I prize the sweet strong drink of thee the Warrior-God,

Sanskit Text: घर्तं न यो हरिभिश्चारु सेचत आ तवाविशन्तु हरिवर्पसं गिरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtaṃ na yo haribhiścāru secata ā tvāviśantu harivarpasaṃ ghiraḥ ||
Translation: His who pours lovely oil as ’twere with yellow drops. Let my songs enter thee whose form hath golden tints.

Sanskit Text: हरिं हि योनिमभि ये समस्वरन हिन्वन्तो हरी दिव्यंयथा सदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hariṃ hi yonimabhi ye samasvaran hinvanto harī divyaṃyathā sadaḥ |
Translation: 2 Ye who in concert sing unto the goldhued place, like Bay Steeds driving onward to the heavenly seat,

Sanskit Text: आ यं पर्णन्ति हरिभिर्न धेनव इन्द्रायशूषं हरिवन्तमर्चत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yaṃ pṛṇanti haribhirna dhenava indrāyaśūṣaṃ harivantamarcata ||
Translation: For Indra laud ye strength allied with Tawny Steeds, laud him whom cows content as ’twere with yellow drops.

Sanskit Text: सो अस्य वज्रो हरितो य आयसो हरिर्निकामो हरिरागभस्त्योः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: so asya vajro harito ya āyaso harirnikāmo harirāghabhastyoḥ |
Translation: 3 His is that thunderbolt, of iron, goldenhued, gold-coloured, very dear, and yellow in his arms;

Sanskit Text: दयुम्नी सुशिप्रो हरिमन्युसायक इन्द्रे नि रूपाहरिता मिमिक्षिरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dyumnī suśipro harimanyusāyaka indre ni rūpāharitā mimikṣire ||
Translation: Bright with strong teeth, destroying with its tawny rage. In Indra are set fast all forms of golden hue.

Sanskit Text: दिवि न केतुरधि धायि हर्यतो विव्यचद वज्रो हरितो नरंह्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divi na keturadhi dhāyi haryato vivyacad vajro harito naraṃhyā |
Translation: 4 As if a lovely ray were laid upon the sky, the golden thunderbolt spread out as in a race.

Sanskit Text: तुददहिं हरिशिप्रो य आयसः सहस्रशोकाभवद धरिम्भरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tudadahiṃ hariśipro ya āyasaḥ sahasraśokāabhavad dharimbharaḥ ||
Translation: That iron bolt with yellow jaw smote Ahi down. A thousand flames had he who bore the tawny-hued.

Sanskit Text: तवं-तवमहर्यथा उपस्तुतः पूर्वेभिरिन्द्र हरिकेशयज्वभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ-tvamaharyathā upastutaḥ pūrvebhirindra harikeśayajvabhiḥ |
Translation: 5 Thou, thou, when praised by men who sacrificed of old. hadst pleasure in their lauds, O Indra golden-haired.

Sanskit Text: तवं हर्यसि तव विश्वमुक्थ्यमसामि राधोहरिजात हर्यतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ haryasi tava viśvamukthyamasāmi rādhoharijāta haryatam ||
Translation: All that befits thy song of praise thou welcornest, the perfect pleasant gift, O Golden-hued from birth.

Sanskit Text: ता वज्रिणं मन्दिनं सतोम्यं मद इन्द्रं रथे वहतोहर्यता हरी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā vajriṇaṃ mandinaṃ stomyaṃ mada indraṃ rathe vahatoharyatā harī |
Translation: 6 These two dear Bays bring hither Indra on his car, Thunder-armed, joyous, meet for laud, to drink his fill.

Sanskit Text: पुरूण्यस्मै सवनानि हर्यत इन्द्रायसोमा हरयो दधन्विरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purūṇyasmai savanāni haryata indrāyasomā harayo dadhanvire ||
Translation: Many libations flow for him who loveth them: to Indra have the gold-hued Soma juices run.

Sanskit Text: अरं कामाय हरयो दधन्विरे सथिराय हिन्वन हरयो हरीतुरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: araṃ kāmāya harayo dadhanvire sthirāya hinvan harayo harīturā |
Translation: 7 Tle gold-hued drops have flowed to gratify his wish: the yellow dro s have urged the swift Bays to the Strong.

Sanskit Text: अर्वद्भिर्यो हरिभिर्जोषमीयते सो अस्य कामंहरिवन्तमानशे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvadbhiryo haribhirjoṣamīyate so asya kāmaṃharivantamānaśe ||
Translation: He who speeds on with Bay Steeds even as he lists hath satisfied his longing for the golden drops.

Sanskit Text: हरिश्मशारुर्हरिकेश आयसस्तुरस्पेये यो हरिपावर्धत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hariśmaśārurharikeśa āyasasturaspeye yo haripāavardhata |
Translation: 8 At the swift draught the Soma-drinker waxed in might, the Iron One with yellow beard and yellow hair.

Sanskit Text: अर्वद्भिर्यो हरिभिर्वाजिनीवसुरति विश्वादुरिता पारिषद धरी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvadbhiryo haribhirvājinīvasurati viśvāduritā pāriṣad dharī ||
Translation: He, Lord of Tawny Coursers, Lord of fleet-foot Mares, will bear his Bay Steeds safely over all distress.

Sanskit Text: सरुवेव यस्य हरिणी विपेततुः शिप्रे वाजाय हरिणीदविध्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sruveva yasya hariṇī vipetatuḥ śipre vājāya hariṇīdavidhvataḥ |
Translation: 9 His yellow-coloured jaws, like ladles move apart, what time, for strength, he makes the yellow-tinted stir,

Sanskit Text: पर यत कर्ते चमसे मर्म्र्जद धरी पीत्वामदस्य हयतस्याधसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra yat kṛte camase marmṛjad dharī pītvāmadasya hayatasyādhasaḥ ||
Translation: When, while the bowl stands there, he grooms his Tawny Steeds, when he hath drunk strong drink, the sweet juice that he loves.

Sanskit Text: उत सम सद्म हर्यतस्य पस्त्योरत्यो न वाजं हरिवानचिक्रदत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta sma sadma haryatasya pastyoratyo na vājaṃ harivānacikradat |
Translation: 10 Yea, to the Dear One's seat in homes of heaven and earth the Bay Steeds' Lord hath whinnied like a horse for food.

Sanskit Text: मही चिद धि धिषणाहर्यदोजसा बर्हद वयोदधिषे हर्यतश्चिदा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahī cid dhi dhiṣaṇāharyadojasā bṛhad vayodadhiṣe haryataścidā ||
Translation: Then the great wish hath seized upon him mightily, and the Beloved One hath gained high power of life,

Sanskit Text: आ रोदसी हर्यमाणो महित्वा नव्यं-नव्यं हर्यसि मन्मनु परियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā rodasī haryamāṇo mahitvā navyaṃ-navyaṃ haryasi manmanu priyam |
Translation: 11 Thou, comprehending with thy might the earth and heaven, acceptest the dear hymn for ever new and new.

Sanskit Text: पर पस्त्यमसुर हर्यतं गोराविष्क्र्धि हरयेसूर्याय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra pastyamasura haryataṃ ghorāviṣkṛdhi harayesūryāya ||
Translation: O Asura, disclose thou and make visible the Cow's beloved home to the bright golden Sun.

Sanskit Text: आ तवा हर्यन्तं परयुजो जनानां रथे वहन्तु हरिशिप्रमिन्द्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tvā haryantaṃ prayujo janānāṃ rathe vahantu hariśipramindra |
Translation: 12 O Indra, let the eager wishes of the folk bring thee, delightful, golden-visored, on thy car,

Sanskit Text: पिबा यथा परतिभ्र्तस्य मध्वो हर्यन यज्ञंसधमादे दशोणिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibā yathā pratibhṛtasya madhvo haryan yajñaṃsadhamāde daśoṇim ||
Translation: That, pleased with sacrifice wherein ten fingers toil, thou mayest, at the feast, drink of our offered meath.

Sanskit Text: अपाः पूर्वेषां हरिवः सुतानामथो इदं सवनंकेवलं ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāḥ pūrveṣāṃ harivaḥ sutānāmatho idaṃ savanaṃkevalaṃ te |
Translation: 13 Juices aforetime, Lord of Bays, thou drankest; and thine especially is this libation.

Sanskit Text: ममद्धि सोमं मधुमन्तमिन्द्र सत्रा वर्षञ्जठर आ वर्षस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mamaddhi somaṃ madhumantamindra satrā vṛṣañjaṭhara ā vṛṣasva ||
Translation: Gladden thee, Indra, with the meath-rich Soma: pour it down ever, Mighty One! within thee.

Sanskit Text: या ओषधीः पूर्वा जाता देवेभ्यस्त्रियुगं पुरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā oṣadhīḥ pūrvā jātā devebhyastriyughaṃ purā |
Translation: 1. HERBS that sprang up in time of old, three ages earlier than the Gods,—

Sanskit Text: मनैनु बभ्रूणामहं शतं धामानि सप्त च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manainu babhrūṇāmahaṃ śataṃ dhāmāni sapta ca ||
Translation: Of these, whose hue is brown, will I declare the hundred powers and seven.

Sanskit Text: शतं वो अम्ब धामानि सहस्रमुत वो रुहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ vo amba dhāmāni sahasramuta vo ruhaḥ |
Translation: 2 Ye, Mothers, have a hundred homes, yea, and a thousand are your growths.

Sanskit Text: अधाशतक्रत्वो यूयमिमं मे अगदं कर्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhāśatakratvo yūyamimaṃ me aghadaṃ kṛta ||
Translation: Do ye who have a thousand powers free this my patient from disease.

Sanskit Text: ओषधीः परति मोदध्वं पुष्पवतीः परसूवरीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: oṣadhīḥ prati modadhvaṃ puṣpavatīḥ prasūvarīḥ |
Translation: 3 Be glad and joyful in the Plants, both blossoming and bearing fruit,

Sanskit Text: अश्वािव सजित्वरीर्वीरुधः पारयिष्ण्वः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvāiva sajitvarīrvīrudhaḥ pārayiṣṇvaḥ ||
Translation: Plants that will lead us to success like mares who conquer in the race.

Sanskit Text: ओषधीरिति मातरस्तद वो देवीरुप बरुवे |
