Sanskrit Transliteration: oṣadhīriti mātarastad vo devīrupa bruve |
Translation: 4 Plants, by this name I speak to you, Mothers, to you the Goddesses:

Sanskit Text: सनेयमश्वंगां वास आत्मानं तव पूरुष ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saneyamaśvaṃghāṃ vāsa ātmānaṃ tava pūruṣa ||
Translation: Steed, cow, and garment may I win, win back thy very self, O man.

Sanskit Text: अश्वत्थे वो निषदनं पर्णे वो वसतिष कर्ता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvatthe vo niṣadanaṃ parṇe vo vasatiṣ kṛtā |
Translation: 5 The Holy Fig tree is your home, your mansion is the Parna tree:

Sanskit Text: गोभाज इत्किलासथ यत सनवथ पूरुषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghobhāja itkilāsatha yat sanavatha pūruṣam ||
Translation: Winners of cattle shali ye be if ye regain for me this man.

Sanskit Text: यत्रौषधीः समग्मत राजानः समिताविव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatrauṣadhīḥ samaghmata rājānaḥ samitāviva |
Translation: 6 He who hath store of Herbs at hand like Kings amid a crowd of men,—

Sanskit Text: विप्रः सौच्यते भिषग रक्षोहामीवचातनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vipraḥ saucyate bhiṣagh rakṣohāmīvacātanaḥ ||
Translation: Physician is that sage's name, fiend-slayer, chaser of disease.

Sanskit Text: अश्वावतीं सोमावतीमूर्जयन्तीमुदोजसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvāvatīṃ somāvatīmūrjayantīmudojasam |
Translation: 7 Herbs rich in Soma, rich in steeds, in nourishments, in strengthening power,—

Sanskit Text: आवित्सिसर्वा ओषधीरस्मा अरिष्टतातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvitsisarvā oṣadhīrasmā ariṣṭatātaye ||
Translation: All these have I provided here, that this man may be whole again.

Sanskit Text: उच्छुष्मा ओषधीनां गावो गोष्ठादिवेरते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ucchuṣmā oṣadhīnāṃ ghāvo ghoṣṭhādiverate |
Translation: 8 The healing virtues of the Plants stream forth like cattle from the stall,—

Sanskit Text: धनंसनिष्यन्तीनामात्मानं तव पूरुष ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhanaṃsaniṣyantīnāmātmānaṃ tava pūruṣa ||
Translation: Plants that shall win me store of wealth, and save thy vital breath, O man.

Sanskit Text: इष्क्र्तिर्नाम वो माताथो यूयं सथ निष्क्र्तीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣkṛtirnāma vo mātātho yūyaṃ stha niṣkṛtīḥ |
Translation: 9 Reliever is your mother's name, and hence Restorers are ye called.

Sanskit Text: सीराःपतत्र्णी सथन यदामयति निष कर्थ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sīrāḥpatatṛṇī sthana yadāmayati niṣ kṛtha ||
Translation: Rivers are ye with wings that fly: keep far whatever brings disease.

Sanskit Text: अति विश्वाः परिष्ठा सतेन इव वरजमक्रमुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ati viśvāḥ pariṣṭhā stena iva vrajamakramuḥ |
Translation: 10 Over all fences have they passed, as steals a thief into the fold.

Sanskit Text: ओषधीःप्राचुच्यवुर्यत किं च तन्वो रपः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: oṣadhīḥprācucyavuryat kiṃ ca tanvo rapaḥ ||
Translation: The Plants have driven from the frame whatever malady was there.

Sanskit Text: यदिमा वाजयन्नहमोषधीर्हस्त आदधे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadimā vājayannahamoṣadhīrhasta ādadhe |
Translation: 11 When, bringing back the vanished strength, I hold these herbs within my hand,

Sanskit Text: आत्मायक्ष्मस्य नश्यति पुरा जीवग्र्भो यथा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ātmāyakṣmasya naśyati purā jīvaghṛbho yathā ||
Translation: The spirit of disease departs ere he can seize upon the life.

Sanskit Text: यस्यौषधीः परसर्पथाङगम-अञ्गं परुष-परुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasyauṣadhīḥ prasarpathāṅgham-añghaṃ paruṣ-paruḥ |
Translation: 12 He through whose frame, O Plants, ye creep member by member, joint by joint,—

Sanskit Text: ततोयक्ष्मं वि बाधध्व उग्रो मध्यमशीरिव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tatoyakṣmaṃ vi bādhadhva ughro madhyamaśīriva ||
Translation: From him ye drive away disease like some strong arbiter of strife.

Sanskit Text: साकं यक्ष्म पर पत चाषेण किकिदीविना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sākaṃ yakṣma pra pata cāṣeṇa kikidīvinā |
Translation: 13 Fly, Spirit of Disease, begone, with the blue jay and kingfisher.

Sanskit Text: साकंवातस्य धराज्या साकं नश्य निहाकया ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sākaṃvātasya dhrājyā sākaṃ naśya nihākayā ||
Translation: Fly with the wind's impetuousspeed, vanish together with the storm.

Sanskit Text: अन्या वो अन्यामवत्वन्यान्यस्या उपावत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anyā vo anyāmavatvanyānyasyā upāvata |
Translation: 14 Help every one the other, lend assistance each of you to each,

Sanskit Text: ताः सर्वाःसंविदाना इदं मे परावता वचः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāḥ sarvāḥsaṃvidānā idaṃ me prāvatā vacaḥ ||
Translation: All of you be accordant, give furtherance to this speech of mine.

Sanskit Text: याः फलिनीर्या अफला अपुष्पा याश्च पुष्पिणीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāḥ phalinīryā aphalā apuṣpā yāśca puṣpiṇīḥ |
Translation: 15 Let fruitful Plants, and fruitless, those that blossom, and the blossomless,

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिप्रसूतास्ता नो मुञ्चन्त्वंहसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiprasūtāstā no muñcantvaṃhasaḥ ||
Translation: Urged onward by Bṛhaspati, release us from our pain and grief;

Sanskit Text: मुञ्चन्तु मा शपथ्यादथो वरुण्यादुत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: muñcantu mā śapathyādatho varuṇyāduta |
Translation: 16 Release me from the curse's plague and woe that comes from Varuṇa;

Sanskit Text: अथो यमस्यपड्बीशात सर्वस्माद देवकिल्बिषात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atho yamasyapaḍbīśāt sarvasmād devakilbiṣāt ||
Translation: Free me from Yama's fetter, from sin and offence against the Gods.

Sanskit Text: अवपतन्तीरवदन दिव ओषधयस परि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avapatantīravadan diva oṣadhayas pari |
Translation: 17 What time, descending from the sky, the Plants flew earthward, thus they spake:

Sanskit Text: यं जीवमश्नवामहै न स रिष्याति पूरुषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ jīvamaśnavāmahai na sa riṣyāti pūruṣaḥ ||
Translation: No evil shall befall the man whom while he liveth we pervade,

Sanskit Text: या ओषधीः सोमराज्ञीर्बह्वीः शतविचक्षणाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā oṣadhīḥ somarājñīrbahvīḥ śatavicakṣaṇāḥ |
Translation: 18 Of all the many Plants whose King is, Soma, Plants of hundred forms,

Sanskit Text: तासां तवमस्युत्तमारं कामाय शं हर्दे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāsāṃ tvamasyuttamāraṃ kāmāya śaṃ hṛde ||
Translation: Thou art the Plant most excellent, prompt to the wish, sweet to the heart.

Sanskit Text: या ओषधीः सोमराज्ञीर्विष्ठिताः पर्थिवीमनु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā oṣadhīḥ somarājñīrviṣṭhitāḥ pṛthivīmanu |
Translation: 19 O all ye various Herbs whose King is Soma, that o’erspread the earth,

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिप्रसूता अस्यै सं दत्त वीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiprasūtā asyai saṃ datta vīryam ||
Translation: Urged onward by Bṛhaspati, combine your virtue in this Plant.

Sanskit Text: मा वो रिषत खनिता यस्मै चाहं खनामि वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā vo riṣat khanitā yasmai cāhaṃ khanāmi vaḥ |
Translation: 20 Unharmed be he who digs you up, unharmed the man for whom I dig:

Sanskit Text: दविपच्चतुष्पदस्माकं सर्वमस्त्वनातुरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvipaccatuṣpadasmākaṃ sarvamastvanāturam ||
Translation: And let no malady attack biped or quadruped of ours.

Sanskit Text: याश्चेदमुपश्र्ण्वन्ति याश्च दूरं परागताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāścedamupaśṛṇvanti yāśca dūraṃ parāghatāḥ |
Translation: 21 All Plants that hear this speech, and those that have departed far away,

Sanskit Text: सर्वाः संगत्य वीरुधो.अस्यै सं दत्त वीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarvāḥ saṃghatya vīrudho.asyai saṃ datta vīryam ||
Translation: Come all assembled and confer your healing power upon this Herb.

Sanskit Text: ओषधयः सं वदन्ते सोमेन सह राज्ञा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: oṣadhayaḥ saṃ vadante somena saha rājñā |
Translation: 22 With Soma as their Sovran Lord the Plants hold colloquy and say:

Sanskit Text: यस्मै कर्णोतिब्राह्मणस्तं राजन पारयामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasmai kṛṇotibrāhmaṇastaṃ rājan pārayāmasi ||
Translation: O King, we save from death the man whose cure a Brahman undertakes.

Sanskit Text: तवमुत्तमास्योषधे तव वर्क्षा उपस्तयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamuttamāsyoṣadhe tava vṛkṣā upastayaḥ |
Translation: 23 Most excellent of all art thou, O Plant thy vassals are the trees.

Sanskit Text: उपस्तिरस्तुसो.अस्माकं यो अस्मानभिदासति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upastirastuso.asmākaṃ yo asmānabhidāsati ||
Translation: Let him be subject to our power, the man who seeks to injure us.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पते परति मे देवतामिहि मित्रो वा यद वरुणो वासिपूषा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspate prati me devatāmihi mitro vā yad varuṇo vāsipūṣā |
Translation: 1. COME, be thou Mitra, Varuṇa, or Pūṣan, come, O Bṛhaspati, to mine oblation:

Sanskit Text: आदित्यैर्वा यद वसुभिर्मरुत्वान स पर्जन्यंशन्तनवे वर्षाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityairvā yad vasubhirmarutvān sa parjanyaṃśantanave vṛṣāya ||
Translation: With Maruts, Vasus, or Ādityas, make thou Parjanya pour for Santanu his rain-drops.

Sanskit Text: आ देवो दूतो अजिरश्चिकित्वान तवद देवापे अभि मामगछत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā devo dūto ajiraścikitvān tvad devāpe abhi māmaghachat |
Translation: 2 The God, intelligent, the speedy envoy whom thou hast sent hath come to me, Devapi:

Sanskit Text: परतीचीनः परति मामा वव्र्त्स्व दधामि ते दयुमतींवाचमासन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratīcīnaḥ prati māmā vavṛtsva dadhāmi te dyumatīṃvācamāsan ||
Translation: Address thyself to me and turn thee hither within thy lips will I put brilliant language.

Sanskit Text: अस्मे धेहि दयुमतीं वाचमासन बर्हस्पते अनमीवामिषिराम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asme dhehi dyumatīṃ vācamāsan bṛhaspate anamīvāmiṣirām |
Translation: 3 Within my mouth, Bṛhaspati, deposit speech lucid, vigorous, and free from weakness,

Sanskit Text: यया वर्ष्टिं शन्तनवे वनाव दिवो दरप्सोमधुमाना विवेश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayā vṛṣṭiṃ śantanave vanāva divo drapsomadhumānā viveśa ||
Translation: Thereby to win for Santanu the rain-fall. The meath-rich drop from heaven hath passed within it.

Sanskit Text: आ नो दरप्सा मधुमन्तो विशन्त्विन्द्र देह्यधिरथंसहस्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no drapsā madhumanto viśantvindra dehyadhirathaṃsahasram |
Translation: 4 Let the sweet drops descend on us, O Indra: give us enough to lade a thousand wagons.

Sanskit Text: नि षीद होत्रं रतुथा यजस्व देवान देवापेहविषा सपर्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni ṣīda hotraṃ ṛtuthā yajasva devān devāpehaviṣā saparya ||
Translation: Sit to thy Hotar task; pay worship duly, and serve the Gods, Devapi, with oblation.

Sanskit Text: आर्ष्टिषेणो होत्रं रषिर्निषीदन देवापिर्देवसुमतिंचिकित्वान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ārṣṭiṣeṇo hotraṃ ṛṣirniṣīdan devāpirdevasumatiṃcikitvān |
Translation: 5 Knowing the God's good-will, Devapi, Ṛṣi, the son of Rstisena, sate as Hotar.

Sanskit Text: स उत्तरस्मादधरं समुद्रमपो दिव्या अस्र्जद्वर्ष्या अभि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa uttarasmādadharaṃ samudramapo divyā asṛjadvarṣyā abhi ||
Translation: He hath brought down from heaven's most lofty summit the ocean of the rain, celestial waters.

Sanskit Text: अस्मिन समुद्रे अध्युत्तरस्मिन्नापो देवेभिर्निव्र्ता अतिष्ठन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmin samudre adhyuttarasminnāpo devebhirnivṛtā atiṣṭhan |
Translation: 6 Gathered together in that highest ocean, the waters stood by deities obstructed.

Sanskit Text: ता अद्रवन्नार्ष्टिषेणेन सर्ष्टा देवापिना परेषिताम्र्क्षिणीषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā adravannārṣṭiṣeṇena sṛṣṭā devāpinā preṣitāmṛkṣiṇīṣu ||
Translation: They burried down set free by Arstisena, in gaping clefts, urged onward by Devapi.

Sanskit Text: यद देवापिः शन्तनवे पुरोहितो होत्राय वर्तः कर्पयन्नदीधेत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad devāpiḥ śantanave purohito hotrāya vṛtaḥ kṛpayannadīdhet |
Translation: 7 When as chief priest for Santanu, Devapi, chosen for Hotar's duty, prayed beseeching,

Sanskit Text: देवश्रुतं वर्ष्टिवनिं रराणो बर्हस्पतिर्वाचमस्मा अयछत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devaśrutaṃ vṛṣṭivaniṃ rarāṇo bṛhaspatirvācamasmā ayachat ||
Translation: Graciously pleased Bṛhaspati vouchsafed him a voice that reached the Gods and won the waters.

Sanskit Text: यं तवा देवापिः शुशुचानो अग्न आर्ष्टिषेणो मनुष्यःसमीधे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ tvā devāpiḥ śuśucāno aghna ārṣṭiṣeṇo manuṣyaḥsamīdhe |
Translation: 8 O Agni whom Devapi Arstisena, the mortal man, hath kindled in his glory,

Sanskit Text: विश्वेभिर्देवैरनुमद्यमानः पर पर्जन्यमीरया वर्ष्टिमन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvebhirdevairanumadyamānaḥ pra parjanyamīrayā vṛṣṭimantam ||
Translation: Joying in him with all the Gods together, urge on the sender of the rain, Parjanya.

Sanskit Text: तवां पूर्व रषयो गीर्भिरायन तवामध्वरेषु पुरुहूतविश्वे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ pūrva ṛṣayo ghīrbhirāyan tvāmadhvareṣu puruhūtaviśve |
Translation: 9 All ancient Ṛṣis with their songs approached thee, even thee, O Much-invoked, at sacrifices.

Sanskit Text: सहस्राण्यधिरथान्यस्मे आ नो यज्ञंरोहिदश्वोप याहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasrāṇyadhirathānyasme ā no yajñaṃrohidaśvopa yāhi ||
Translation: We have provided wagon-loads in thousands: come to the solemn rite, Lord of Red Horses.

Sanskit Text: एतान्यग्ने नवतिर्नव तवे आहुतान्यधिरथा सहस्र |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etānyaghne navatirnava tve āhutānyadhirathā sahasra |
Translation: 10 The wagon-loads, the nine-and-ninety thousand, these have been offered up to thee, O Agni.

Sanskit Text: तेभिर्वर्धस्व तन्वः शूर पूर्वीर्दिवो नो वर्ष्टिमिषितोरिरीहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tebhirvardhasva tanvaḥ śūra pūrvīrdivo no vṛṣṭimiṣitorirīhi ||
Translation: Hero, with these increase thy many bodies, and, stimulated, send us rain from heaven.

Sanskit Text: एतान्यग्ने नवतिं सहस्रा सं पर यछ वर्ष्ण इन्द्रायभागम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etānyaghne navatiṃ sahasrā saṃ pra yacha vṛṣṇa indrāyabhāgham |
Translation: 11 Give thou these ninety thousand loads, O Agni, to Indra, to the Bull, to be his portion.

Sanskit Text: विद्वान पथ रतुशो देवयानानप्यौलानं दिविदेवेषु धेहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vidvān patha ṛtuśo devayānānapyaulānaṃ divideveṣu dhehi ||
Translation: Knowing the paths which Deities duly travel, set mid the Gods in heaven Aulana also.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने बाधस्व वि मर्धो वि दुर्गहापामीवामपरक्षांसि सेध |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne bādhasva vi mṛdho vi durghahāpāmīvāmaparakṣāṃsi sedha |
Translation: 12 O Agni, drive afar our foes, our troubles chase malady away and wicked demons.

Sanskit Text: अस्मात समुद्राद बर्हतो दिवो नो.अपाम्भूमानमुप नः सर्जेह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmāt samudrād bṛhato divo no.apāmbhūmānamupa naḥ sṛjeha ||
Translation: From this air-ocean, from the lofty heavens, send down on us a mighty flood of waters.

Sanskit Text: कं नश्चित्रमिषण्यसि चिकित्वान पर्थुग्मानं वाश्रंवाव्र्धध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaṃ naścitramiṣaṇyasi cikitvān pṛthughmānaṃ vāśraṃvāvṛdhadhyai |
Translation: 1. WHAT Splendid One, Loud-voiced, Farstriding, dost thou, well knowing, urge us to exalt with praises?

Sanskit Text: कत तस्य दातु शवसो वयुष्टौ तक्षद्वज्रं वर्त्रतुरमपिन्वत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kat tasya dātu śavaso vyuṣṭau takṣadvajraṃ vṛtraturamapinvat ||
Translation: What give we him? When his might dawned, he fashioned the Vṛtra-slaying bolt, and sent us waters.

Sanskit Text: स हि दयुता विद्युता वेति साम पर्थुं योनिमसुरत्वाससाद |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa hi dyutā vidyutā veti sāma pṛthuṃ yonimasuratvāsasāda |
Translation: 2 He goes to end his work with lightning flashes: wide is the seat his Asura glory gives him.

Sanskit Text: स सनीळेभिः परसहानो अस्य भरातुर्न रतेसप्तथस्य मायाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sanīḷebhiḥ prasahāno asya bhrāturna ṛtesaptathasya māyāḥ ||
Translation: With his Companions, not without his Brother, he quells Saptatha's magic devices.

Sanskit Text: स वाजं यातापदुष्पदा यन सवर्षाता परि षदत्सनिष्यन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vājaṃ yātāpaduṣpadā yan svarṣātā pari ṣadatsaniṣyan |
Translation: 3 On most auspicious path he goes to battle he toiled to win heaven's light, full fain to gain it;

Sanskit Text: अनर्वा यच्छतदुरस्य वेदो घनञ्छिश्नदेवानभि वर्पसा भूत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anarvā yacchatadurasya vedo ghnañchiśnadevānabhi varpasā bhūt ||
Translation: He seized the hundred-gated castle's treasure by craft, unchecked, and slew the lustful demons.

Sanskit Text: स यह्व्यो.अवनीर्गोष्वर्वा जुहोति परधन्यासु सस्रिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa yahvyo.avanīrghoṣvarvā juhoti pradhanyāsu sasriḥ |
Translation: 4 Fighting for kine, the prize of war, and I roaming among the berd be brings the young streams hither,

Sanskit Text: अपादो यत्र युज्यासो.अरथा दरोण्यश्वास ईरते घर्तंवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apādo yatra yujyāso.arathā droṇyaśvāsa īrate ghṛtaṃvāḥ ||
Translation: Where, footless, joined, without a car to bear them, with jars for steeds, they pour their flood like butter.

Sanskit Text: स रुद्रेभिरशस्तवार रभ्वा हित्वी गयमारेवद्यागात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa rudrebhiraśastavāra ṛbhvā hitvī ghayamāreavadyaāghāt |
Translation: 5 Bold, unsolicited for wealth, with Rudras he came, the Blameless, having left his dwelling,

Sanskit Text: वम्रस्य मन्ये मिथुना विवव्री अन्नमभीत्यारोदयन्मुषायन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vamrasya manye mithunā vivavrī annamabhītyārodayanmuṣāyan ||
Translation: Came, seized the food of Vamra and his consort, and left the couple weeping and unsheltered.

Sanskit Text: स इद दासं तुवीरवं पतिर्दन षळक्षन्त्रिशीर्षाणं दमन्यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa id dāsaṃ tuvīravaṃ patirdan ṣaḷakṣantriśīrṣāṇaṃ damanyat |
Translation: 6 Lord of the dwelling, he subdued the demon who roared aloud, six-eyed and triple-headed.

Sanskit Text: अस्य तरितो नवोजसा वर्धानो विपावराहमयोग्रया हन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya trito nvojasā vṛdhāno vipāvarāhamayoaghrayā han ||
Translation: Tṛta, made stronger by the might he lent him, struck down the boar with shaft whose point was iron.

Sanskit Text: स दरुह्वणे मनुष ऊर्ध्वसान आ साविषदर्शसानायशरुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa druhvaṇe manuṣa ūrdhvasāna ā sāviṣadarśasānāyaśarum |
Translation: 7 He raised himself on high and shot his arrow against the guileful and oppressive foeman.

Sanskit Text: स नर्तमो नहुषो.अस्मत सुजातः पुरो.अभिनदर्हन्दस्युहत्ये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa nṛtamo nahuṣo.asmat sujātaḥ puro.abhinadarhandasyuhatye ||
Translation: Strong, glorious, manliest, for us he shattered the forts of Nabus when he slew the Dasyus.

Sanskit Text: सो अभ्रियो न यवस उदन्यन कषयाय गातुं विदन नो अस्मे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: so abhriyo na yavasa udanyan kṣayāya ghātuṃ vidan no asme |
Translation: 8 He, like a cloud that rains upon the pasture, hath found for us the way to dwell in safety.

Sanskit Text: उप यत सीददिन्दुं शरीरैः शयेनो.अयोपाष्टिर्हन्तिदस्यून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa yat sīdadinduṃ śarīraiḥ śyeno.ayopāṣṭirhantidasyūn ||
Translation: When the Hawk comes in body to the Soma, armed with his iron claws he slays the Dasyus.

Sanskit Text: स वराधतः शवसानेभिरस्य कुत्साय शुष्णं कर्पणेपरादात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa vrādhataḥ śavasānebhirasya kutsāya śuṣṇaṃ kṛpaṇeparādāt |
Translation: 9 He with his potent Friends gave up the mighty, gave gusnia up to Kutsa for affliction.

Sanskit Text: अयं कविमनयच्छस्यमानमत्कं वो अस्यसनितोत नर्णाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ kavimanayacchasyamānamatkaṃ vo asyasanitota nṛṇām ||
Translation: He led the lauded Kavi, he delivered Atka as prey to him and to his heroes.

Sanskit Text: अयं दशस्यन नर्येभिरस्य दस्मो देवेभिर्वरुणो नमायी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ daśasyan naryebhirasya dasmo devebhirvaruṇo namāyī |
Translation: 10 He, with his Gods who love mankind, the Wondrous, giving like Varuṇa who works with magic,

Sanskit Text: अयं कनीन रतुपा अवेद्यमिमीताररुं यश्चतुष्पात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ kanīna ṛtupā avedyamimītāraruṃ yaścatuṣpāt ||
Translation: Was known, yet young as guardian of the seasons; and he quelled Araru, four-footed dernon.

Sanskit Text: अस्य सतोमेभिरौशिज रजिश्वा वरजं दरयद वर्षभेणपिप्रोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya stomebhirauśija ṛjiśvā vrajaṃ darayad vṛṣabheṇapiproḥ |
Translation: 11 Through lauds of him hath Auśija Ṛjiśvan burst, with the Mighty's aid, the stall of Pipru.

Sanskit Text: सुत्वा यद यजतो दीदयद गीः पुर इयानो अभिवर्पसा भूत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sutvā yad yajato dīdayad ghīḥ pura iyāno abhivarpasā bhūt ||
Translation: When the saint pressed the juice and shone as singer, he seized the forts and with his craft subdued them.

Sanskit Text: एवा महो असुर वक्षथाय वम्रकः पड्भिरुप सर्पदिन्द्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā maho asura vakṣathāya vamrakaḥ paḍbhirupa sarpadindram |
Translation: 12 So, swiftly Asura, for exaltation, hath the great Vamraka come nigh to Indra.

Sanskit Text: स इयानः करति सवस्तिमस्मा इषमूर्जंसुक्षितिं विश्वमाभाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa iyānaḥ karati svastimasmā iṣamūrjaṃsukṣitiṃ viśvamābhāḥ ||
Translation: He will, when supplicated, bring him blessing: he hath brought all, food, strength, a happy dwelling.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र दर्ह्य मघवन तवावदिद भुज इह सतुतः सुतपाबोधि नो वर्धे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra dṛhya maghavan tvāvadid bhuja iha stutaḥ sutapābodhi no vṛdhe |
Translation: 1. Be, like thyself, O Indra, strong for our delight: here lauded, aid us, Maghavan, drinker of the juice.

Sanskit Text: देवेभिर्नः सविता परावतु शरुतमासर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devebhirnaḥ savitā prāvatu śrutamāsarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: Savitar with the Gods protect us: hear ye Twain. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

Sanskit Text: भराय सु भरत भागं रत्वियं पर वायवे शुचिपेक्रन्ददिष्टये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bharāya su bharata bhāghaṃ ṛtviyaṃ pra vāyave śucipekrandadiṣṭaye |
Translation: 2 Bring swift, for offering, the snare that suits the time, to the pure-drinker Vāyu, roaring as he goes,

Sanskit Text: गौरस्य यः पयसः पीतिमानश आसर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghaurasya yaḥ payasaḥ pītimānaśa āsarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: To him who hath approached the draught of shining milk. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

Sanskit Text: आ नो देवः सविता साविषद वय रजूयते यजमानायसुन्वते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no devaḥ savitā sāviṣad vaya ṛjūyate yajamānāyasunvate |
Translation: 3 May Savitar the God send us full life, to each who sacrifices, lives aright and pours the juice

Sanskit Text: यथा देवान परतिभूषेम पाकवदा सर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā devān pratibhūṣema pākavadā sarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: That we with simple hearts may wait upon the Gods. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो अस्मे सुमना अस्तु विश्वहा राजा सोमः सुवितस्याध्येतु नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro asme sumanā astu viśvahā rājā somaḥ suvitasyādhyetu naḥ |
Translation: 4 May Indra evermore be gracious unto us, and may King Soma meditate our happiness,

Sanskit Text: यथा-यथा मित्रधितानि सन्दधुरा सर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā-yathā mitradhitāni sandadhurā sarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: Even as men secure the comfort of a friend. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र उक्थेन शवसा परुर्दधे बर्हस्पते परतरीतास्यायुषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra ukthena śavasā parurdadhe bṛhaspate pratarītāsyāyuṣaḥ |
Translation: 5 Indra hath given the body with its song and strength: Bṛhaspati, thou art the lengthener of life.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञो मनुः परमतिर्नः पिता हि कमासर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajño manuḥ pramatirnaḥ pitā hi kamāsarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: The sacrifice is Manu, Providence, our Sire. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य नु सुक्र्तं दैव्यं सहो.अग्निर्ग्र्हे जरितामेधिरः कविः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya nu sukṛtaṃ daivyaṃ saho.aghnirghṛhe jaritāmedhiraḥ kaviḥ |
Translation: 6 Indra possesseth might celestial nobly formed: the singer in the house is Agni, prudent Sage.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञश्च भूद विदथे चारुरन्तम आसर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñaśca bhūd vidathe cārurantama āsarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: He is the sacrifice in synod, fair, most near. We ask for freedom and complete felicity,

Sanskit Text: न वो गुहा चक्र्म भूरि दुष्क्र्तं नाविष्ट्यं वसवोदेवहेळनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na vo ghuhā cakṛma bhūri duṣkṛtaṃ nāviṣṭyaṃ vasavodevaheḷanam |
Translation: 7 Not often have we sinned against you secretly, nor, Vasus, have we openly provoked the Gods.

Sanskit Text: माकिर्नो देवा अन्र्तस्य वर्पस आ सर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mākirno devā anṛtasya varpasa ā sarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: Not one of its, ye Gods, hath worn an alien shape. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

Sanskit Text: अपामीवां सविता साविषन नयग वरीय इदप सेधन्त्वद्रयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāmīvāṃ savitā sāviṣan nyagh varīya idapa sedhantvadrayaḥ |
Translation: 8 May Savitar remove from us our malady, and may the Mountains keep it far away from where

Sanskit Text: गरावा यत्र मधुषुदुच्यते बर्हदासर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghrāvā yatra madhuṣuducyate bṛhadāsarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: The press-stone as it sheds the meath rings loudly forth. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वो गरावा वसवो.अस्तु सोतरि विश्वा दवेषांसि सनुतर्युयोत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvo ghrāvā vasavo.astu sotari viśvā dveṣāṃsi sanutaryuyota |
Translation: 9 Ye Vasus, let the stone, the presser stand erect: avert all enmities and keep them far remote.

Sanskit Text: स नो देवः सविता पायुरीड्य आ सर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa no devaḥ savitā pāyurīḍya ā sarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: Our guard to be adored is Savitar this God. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्जं गावो यवसे पीवो अत्तन रतस्य याः सदने कोशेङगध्वे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrjaṃ ghāvo yavase pīvo attana ṛtasya yāḥ sadane kośeaṅghdhve |
Translation: 10 Eat strength and fatness in the pasture, kine, who are balmed at the reservoir and at the seat of Law.

Sanskit Text: तनूरेव तन्वो अस्तु भेषजमा सर्वतातिंदितिं वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tanūreva tanvo astu bheṣajamā sarvatātiṃaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: So let your body be our body's medicine. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

Sanskit Text: करतुप्रावा जरिता शश्वतामव इन्द्र इद भद्राप्रमतिः सुतावताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratuprāvā jaritā śaśvatāmava indra id bhadrāpramatiḥ sutāvatām |
Translation: 11 The singer fills the spirit: all mens, love hath he. Indra takes kindly care of those who pour the juice.

Sanskit Text: पूर्णमूधर्दिव्यं यस्य सिक्तया सर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrṇamūdhardivyaṃ yasya siktayaā sarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe ||
Translation: For his libation is the heavenly udder full. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

Sanskit Text: चित्रस्ते भानुः करतुप्रा अभिष्टिः सन्ति सप्र्धोजरणिप्रा अध्र्ष्टाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: citraste bhānuḥ kratuprā abhiṣṭiḥ santi spṛdhojaraṇiprā adhṛṣṭāḥ |
Translation: 12 Wondrous thy spirit-filling light, triumpliant; thy hosts save from decay and are resistless.

Sanskit Text: रजिष्ठया रज्या पश्व आ गोस्तूतूर्षत्य पर्यग्रं दुवस्युः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rajiṣṭhayā rajyā paśva ā ghostūtūrṣaty paryaghraṃ duvasyuḥ ||
Translation: The pious votary by straightest pathway speeds to possess the best of all the cattle.

Sanskit Text: पर ते रथं मिथूक्र्तमिन्द्रो.अवतु धर्ष्णुया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra te rathaṃ mithūkṛtamindro.avatu dhṛṣṇuyā |
Translation: 1. FOR thee may Indra boldly speed the car that works on either side.

Sanskit Text: अस्मिन्नाजौ पुरुहूत शरवाय्ये धनभक्षेषु नो.अव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asminnājau puruhūta śravāyye dhanabhakṣeṣu no.ava ||
Translation: Favour us, Much-invoked! in this most glorious fight against the raiders of our wealth.

Sanskit Text: उत सम वातो वहति वासो.अस्या अधिरथं यदजयत सहस्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut sma vāto vahati vāso.asyā adhirathaṃ yadajayat sahasram |
Translation: 2 Loose in the wind the woman's robe was streaming what time she won a car-load worth a thousand.

Sanskit Text: रथीरभून मुद्गलानी गविष्टौ भरे कर्तं वयचेदिन्द्रसेना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rathīrabhūn mudghalānī ghaviṣṭau bhare kṛtaṃ vyacedindrasenā ||
Translation: The charioteer in fight was Mudgalani: she Indra's dart, heaped up the prize of battle.

Sanskit Text: अन्तर्यछ जिघांसतो वज्रमिन्द्राभिदासतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: antaryacha jighāṃsato vajramindrābhidāsataḥ |
Translation: 3 O Indra, cast thy bolt among assailants who would slaughter us:

Sanskit Text: दासस्यवा मघवन्नार्यस्य वा सनुतर्यवया वधम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dāsasyavā maghavannāryasya vā sanutaryavayā vadham ||
Translation: The weapon both of Dāsa and of Ārya foe keep far away, O Maghavan.

Sanskit Text: उद्नो हरदमपिबज्जर्ह्र्षाणः कूटं सम तरंहदभिमातिमेति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udno hradamapibajjarhṛṣāṇaḥ kūṭaṃ sma tṛṃhadabhimātimeti |
Translation: 4 The bull in joy had drunk a lake of water. His shattering horn encountered an opponent.

Sanskit Text: पर मुष्कभारः शरव इछमानो.अजिरम्बाहू अभरत सिषासन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra muṣkabhāraḥ śrava ichamāno.ajirambāhū abharat siṣāsan ||
Translation: Swiftly, in vigorous strength, eager for glory, he stretched his forefeet, fain to win and triumph.

Sanskit Text: नयक्रन्दयन्नुपयन्त एनममेहयन वर्षभं मध्य आजेः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nyakrandayannupayanta enamamehayan vṛṣabhaṃ madhya ājeḥ |
Translation: 5 They came anear the bull; they made him thunder, made him pour rain down ere the fight was ended.

Sanskit Text: तेन सूभर्वं शतवत सहस्रं गवां मुद्गलः परधनेजिगाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tena sūbharvaṃ śatavat sahasraṃ ghavāṃ mudghalaḥ pradhanejighāya ||
Translation: And Mudgala thereby won in the contest well-pastured kine in hundreds and in thousands.

Sanskit Text: ककर्दवे वर्षभो युक्त आसीदवावचीत सारथिरस्य केशी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kakardave vṛṣabho yukta āsīdavāvacīt sārathirasya keśī |
Translation: 6 In hope of victory that bull was harnessed: Kesi the driver urged him on with shouting.

Sanskit Text: दुधेर्युक्तस्य दरवतः सहानस रछन्ति षमा निष्पदोमुद्गलानीम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dudheryuktasya dravataḥ sahānasa ṛchanti ṣmā niṣpadomudghalānīm ||
Translation: As he ran swiftly with the car behind him his lifted heels pressed close on Mudgalani.

Sanskit Text: उत परधिमुदहन्नस्य विद्वानुपायुनग वंसगमत्रशिक्षन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta pradhimudahannasya vidvānupāyunagh vaṃsaghamatraśikṣan |
Translation: 7 Deftly for him he stretched the car-pole forward, guided the bull thereto and firmly yoked him.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र उदावत पतिमघ्न्यानामरंहतपद्याभिः ककुद्मान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra udāvat patimaghnyānāmaraṃhatapadyābhiḥ kakudmān ||
Translation: Indra vouchsafed the lord of cows his favour: with mighty steps the buffalo ran onward.

Sanskit Text: शुनमष्त्राव्यचरत कपर्दी वरत्रायां दार्वानह्यमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śunamaṣtrāvyacarat kapardī varatrāyāṃ dārvānahyamānaḥ |
Translation: 8 Touched by the goad the shaggy beast went nobly, bound to the pole by the yoke's thong of leather.

Sanskit Text: नर्म्णानि कर्ण्वन बहवे जनाय गाःपस्पशानस्तविषीरधत्त ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛmṇāni kṛṇvan bahave janāya ghāḥpaspaśānastaviṣīradhatta ||
Translation: Performing deeds of might for many people, he, looking on the cows, gained strength and vigour.

Sanskit Text: इमं तं पश्य वर्षभस्य युञ्जं काष्ठाया मध्येद्रुघणं शयानम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ taṃ paśya vṛṣabhasya yuñjaṃ kāṣṭhāyā madhyedrughaṇaṃ śayānam |
Translation: 9 Here look upon this mace, this bull's companion, now lying midway on the field of battle.

Sanskit Text: येन जिगाय शतवत सहस्रं गवाम्मुद्गलः पर्तनाज्येषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena jighāya śatavat sahasraṃ ghavāmmudghalaḥ pṛtanājyeṣu ||
Translation: Therewith hath Mudgala in ordered contest won for cattle for himself, a hundred thousand.

Sanskit Text: आरे अघा को नवित्था ददर्श यं युञ्जन्ति तं वास्थापयन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āre aghā ko nvitthā dadarśa yaṃ yuñjanti taṃ vāsthāpayanti |
Translation: 10 Far is the evil: who hath here beheld it? Hither they bring the bull whom they are yoking..

Sanskit Text: नास्मै तर्णं नोदकमा भरन्त्युत्तरो धुरोवहति परदेदिशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāsmai tṛṇaṃ nodakamā bharantyuttaro dhurovahati pradediśat ||
Translation: To this they give not either food or water. Reaching beyond the pole it gives directions.

Sanskit Text: परिव्र्क्तेव पतिविद्यमानट पीप्याना कूचक्रेणेव सिञ्चन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parivṛkteva patividyamānaṭ pīpyānā kūcakreṇeva siñcan |
Translation: 11 Like one forsaken, she hath found a husband, and teemed as if her breast were full and flowing.

Sanskit Text: एषैष्या चिद रथ्या जयेम सुमङगलं सिनवदस्तु सातम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eṣaiṣyā cid rathyā jayema sumaṅghalaṃ sinavadastu sātam ||
Translation: With swiftly-racing chariot may we conquer, and rich and blessed be our gains in battle.

Sanskit Text: तवं विश्वस्य जगतश्चक्षुरिन्द्रासि चक्षुषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ viśvasya jaghataścakṣurindrāsi cakṣuṣaḥ |
Translation: 12 Thou, Indra, art the mark whereon the eyes of all life rest, when thou,

Sanskit Text: वर्षायदाजिं वर्षणा सिषाससि चोदयन वध्रिणा युजा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣāyadājiṃ vṛṣaṇā siṣāsasi codayan vadhriṇā yujā ||
Translation: A Bull who drivest with thy bull, wilt win the race together with thy weakling friend.

Sanskit Text: आशुः शिशानो वर्षभो न भीमो घनाघनः कषोभणश्चर्षणीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āśuḥ śiśāno vṛṣabho na bhīmo ghanāghanaḥ kṣobhaṇaścarṣaṇīnām |
Translation: 1. SWIFT, rapidly striking, like a bull who sharpens his horns, terrific, stirring up the people,

Sanskit Text: संक्रन्दनो.अनिमिष एकवीरः शतं सेनाजयत साकमिन्द्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃkrandano.animiṣa ekavīraḥ śataṃ senāajayat sākamindraḥ ||
Translation: With eyes that close not, bellowing, Sole Hero, Indra. subdued at once a hundred armies.

Sanskit Text: संक्रन्दनेनानिमिषेण जिष्णुना युत्कारेण दुश्च्यवनेनध्र्ष्णुना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃkrandanenānimiṣeṇa jiṣṇunā yutkāreṇa duścyavanenadhṛṣṇunā |
Translation: 2 With him loud-roaring, ever watchful, Victor, bold, hard to overthrow, Rouser of battle,

Sanskit Text: तदिन्द्रेण जयत तत सहध्वं युधो नरैषुहस्तेन वर्ष्णा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadindreṇa jayata tat sahadhvaṃ yudho naraiṣuhastena vṛṣṇā ||
Translation: Indra. the Strong, whose hand bears arrows, conquer, ye warriors, now, now vanquish in the combat.

Sanskit Text: स इषुहस्तैः स निषङगिभिर्वशी संस्रष्टा स युधैन्द्रो गणेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa iṣuhastaiḥ sa niṣaṅghibhirvaśī saṃsraṣṭā sa yudhaindro ghaṇena |
Translation: 3 He rules with those who carry shafts and quivers, Indra who with his band rings hosts together,

Sanskit Text: संस्र्ष्टजित सोमपा बाहुशर्ध्युग्रधन्वाप्रतिहिताभिरस्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃsṛṣṭajit somapā bāhuśardhyughradhanvāpratihitābhirastā ||
Translation: Foe-conquering, strong of arm, the Soma-drinker, with mighty bow, shooting with well-laid arrows.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पते परि दीया रथेन रक्षोहामित्रानपबाधमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspate pari dīyā rathena rakṣohāmitrānapabādhamānaḥ |
Translation: 4 Bṛhaspati, fly with thy chariot hither, slayer of demons, driving off our foemen.

Sanskit Text: परभञ्जन सेनाः परम्र्णो युधा जयन्नस्माकमेध्यविता रथानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prabhañjan senāḥ pramṛṇo yudhā jayannasmākamedhyavitā rathānām ||
Translation: Be thou protector of our cars, destroyer, victor in battle, breaker-up of armies.

Sanskit Text: बलविज्ञाय सथविरः परवीरः सहस्वान वाजी सहमानौग्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: balavijñāya sthaviraḥ pravīraḥ sahasvān vājī sahamānaughraḥ |
Translation: 5 Conspicuous by thy strength, firm, foremost fighter, mighty and fierce, victorious, all-subduing,

Sanskit Text: अभिवीरो अभिसत्वा सहोजा जैत्रमिन्द्र रथमातिष्ठ गोवित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhivīro abhisatvā sahojā jaitramindra rathamātiṣṭha ghovit ||
Translation: The Son of Conquest, passing men and heroes, kine-winner, mount thy conquering car, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: गोत्रभिदं गोविदं वज्रबाहुं जयन्तमज्म परम्र्णन्तमोजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghotrabhidaṃ ghovidaṃ vajrabāhuṃ jayantamajma pramṛṇantamojasā |
Translation: 6 Cleaver of stalls, kine-winner, armed with thunder, who quells an army and with might destroys it.-

Sanskit Text: इमं सजाता अनु वीरयध्वमिन्द्रं सखायो अनुसं रभध्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ sajātā anu vīrayadhvamindraṃ sakhāyo anusaṃ rabhadhvam ||
Translation: Follow him, brothers! quit yourselves like heroes, and like this Indra show your zeal and courage.

Sanskit Text: अभि गोत्राणि सहसा गाहमानो.अदयो वीरः शतमन्युरिन्द्रः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi ghotrāṇi sahasā ghāhamāno.adayo vīraḥ śatamanyurindraḥ |
Translation: 7 Piercing the cow-stalls with surpassing vigour, Indra, the pitiless Hero, wild with anger,

Sanskit Text: दुश्च्यवनः पर्तनाषाळ अयुध्यो.अस्माकं सेनावतु पर युत्सु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: duścyavanaḥ pṛtanāṣāḷ ayudhyo.asmākaṃ senāavatu pra yutsu ||
Translation: Victor in fight, unshaken and resistless,may he protect our armies in our battles.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र आसां नेता बर्हस्पतिर्दक्षिणा यज्ञः पुर एतुसोमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra āsāṃ netā bṛhaspatirdakṣiṇā yajñaḥ pura etusomaḥ |
Translation: 8 Indra guide these: Bṛhaspati precede them, the guerdon, and the sacrifice, and Soma;

Sanskit Text: देवसेनानामभिभञ्जतीनां जयन्तीनां मरुतोयन्त्वग्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devasenānāmabhibhañjatīnāṃ jayantīnāṃ marutoyantvaghram ||
Translation: And let the banded Maruts march in forefront of heavenly hosts that conquer and demolish.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य वर्ष्णो वरुणस्य राज्ञ आदित्यानां मरुतांशर्ध उग्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya vṛṣṇo varuṇasya rājña ādityānāṃ marutāṃśardha ughram |
Translation: 9 Ours be the potent host of mighty Indra, King Varuṇa, and Maruts, and Ādityas.

Sanskit Text: महामनसां भुवनच्यवानां घोषोदेवानां जयतामुदस्थात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahāmanasāṃ bhuvanacyavānāṃ ghoṣodevānāṃ jayatāmudasthāt ||
Translation: Uplifted is the shout of Gods who conquer high-minded Gods who cause the worlds to tremble.

Sanskit Text: उद धर्षय मघवन्नायुधान्युत सत्वनां मामकानाम्मनांसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud dharṣaya maghavannāyudhānyut satvanāṃ māmakānāmmanāṃsi |
Translation: 10 Bristle thou up, O Maghavan, our weapons: excite the spirits of my warring heroes.

Sanskit Text: उद वर्त्रहन वाजिनां वाजिनान्युद रथानांजयतां यन्तु घोषाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud vṛtrahan vājināṃ vājinānyud rathānāṃjayatāṃ yantu ghoṣāḥ ||
Translation: Urge on the strong steeds' might, O Vṛtra-slayer, and let the din of conquering cars go upward.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकमिन्द्रः सम्र्तेषु धवजेष्वस्माकं या इषवस्ताजयन्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākamindraḥ samṛteṣu dhvajeṣvasmākaṃ yā iṣavastājayantu |
Translation: 11 May Indra aid us when our flags are gathered: victorious be the arrows of our army.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकं वीरा उत्तरे भवन्त्वस्मानु देवा अवताहवेषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākaṃ vīrā uttare bhavantvasmānu devā avatāhaveṣu ||
Translation: May our brave men of war prevail in battle. Ye Gods, protect us in the shout of onset.

Sanskit Text: अमीषां चित्तं परतिलोभयन्ती गर्हाणाङगान्यप्वे परेहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: amīṣāṃ cittaṃ pratilobhayantī ghṛhāṇāṅghānyapve parehi |
Translation: 12 Bewildering the senses of our foemen, seize thou their bodies and depart, O Apva.

Sanskit Text: अभि परेहि निर्दह हर्त्सु शोकैरन्धेनामित्रास्तमसासचन्ताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi prehi nirdaha hṛtsu śokairandhenāmitrāstamasāsacantām ||
Translation: Attack them, set their hearts on fire and burn them: so let our foes abide in utter darkness.

Sanskit Text: परेता जयता नर इन्द्रो वः शर्म यछतु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pretā jayatā nara indro vaḥ śarma yachatu |
Translation: 13 Advance, O heroes, win the day. May Indra be your sure defence.

Sanskit Text: उग्रा वः सन्तुबाहवो.अनाध्र्ष्या यथासथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughrā vaḥ santubāhavo.anādhṛṣyā yathāsatha ||
Translation: Exceeding mighty be your arms, that none may wound or injure you.

Sanskit Text: कदा वसो सतोत्रं हर्यत आव शमशा रुधद वाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kadā vaso stotraṃ haryata āva śmaśā rudhad vāḥ |
Translation: 1. WHEN, Vasu, wilt thou love the laud? Now let the channel bring the stream.

Sanskit Text: दीर्घं सुतं वाताप्याय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dīrghaṃ sutaṃ vātāpyāya ||
Translation: The juice is ready to ferment.

Sanskit Text: हरी यस्य सुयुजा विव्रता वेरर्वन्तानु शेपा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: harī yasya suyujā vivratā verarvantānu śepā |
Translation: 2 He whose two Bay Steeds harnessed well, swerving, pursue the Bird's tail-plumes,

Sanskit Text: उभारजी न केशिना पतिर्दन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhārajī na keśinā patirdan ||
Translation: With Rowing manes, like heaven and earth, he is the Lord with power to give.

Sanskit Text: अप योरिन्द्रः पापज आ मर्तो न शश्रमाणो बिभीवान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa yorindraḥ pāpaja ā marto na śaśramāṇo bibhīvān |
Translation: 3 Bereft of skill is Indra, if, like some outwearied man he fears

Sanskit Text: शुभे यद युयुजे तविषीवान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śubhe yad yuyuje taviṣīvān ||
Translation: The sinner, when the Mighty hath prepared himself for victory.

Sanskit Text: सचायोरिन्द्रश्चर्क्र्ष आनुपानसः सपर्यन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sacāyorindraścarkṛṣa ānupānasaḥ saparyan |
Translation: 4 Indra with these drives round, until he meets with one to worship him:

Sanskit Text: नदयोर्विव्रतयोः शूर इन्द्रः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nadayorvivratayoḥ śūra indraḥ ||
Translation: Indra is Master of the pair who snort and swerve upon their way.

Sanskit Text: अधि यस्तस्थौ केशवन्ता वयचस्वन्ता न पुष्ट्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhi yastasthau keśavantā vyacasvantā na puṣṭyai |
Translation: 5 Borne onward by the long-maned Steeds who stretch themselves as ’twere for food,

Sanskit Text: वनोति शिप्राभ्यां शिप्रिणीवान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanoti śiprābhyāṃ śipriṇīvān ||
Translation: The God who wears the helm defends them with his jaws.

Sanskit Text: परास्तौद रष्वौजा रष्वेभिस्ततक्ष शूरः शवसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāstaud ṛṣvaujā ṛṣvebhistatakṣa śūraḥ śavasā |
Translation: 6 The Mighty sang with Lofty Ones: the Hero fashioned with his strength,

Sanskit Text: रभुर्न करतुभिर्मातरिश्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛbhurna kratubhirmātariśvā ||
Translation: Like skilful Mātariśvan with his power and might,

Sanskit Text: वज्रं यश्चक्रे सुहनाय दस्यवे हिरीमशो हिरीमान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vajraṃ yaścakre suhanāya dasyave hirīmaśo hirīmān |
Translation: 7 The bolt, which pierced at once the vitals of the Dasyu easy to be slain,

Sanskit Text: अरुतहनुरद्भुतं न रजः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arutahanuradbhutaṃ na rajaḥ ||
Translation: With jaw uninjured like the wondrous firmament.

Sanskit Text: अव नो वर्जिना शिशीह्य रचा वनेमान्र्चः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava no vṛjinā śiśīhy ṛcā vanemānṛcaḥ |
Translation: 8 Grind off our sins: with song will we conquer the men who sing no hymns:

Sanskit Text: नाब्रह्मा यज्ञर्धग जोषति तवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nābrahmā yajñaṛdhagh joṣati tve ||
Translation: Not easily art thou pleased with prayerless sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वा यत ते तरेतिनी भूद यज्ञस्य धूर्षु सद्मन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvā yat te tretinī bhūd yajñasya dhūrṣu sadman |
Translation: 9 When threefold flame burns high for thee, to rest on poles of sacrifice,

Sanskit Text: सजूर्नावं सवयशसं सचायोः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajūrnāvaṃ svayaśasaṃ sacāyoḥ ||
Translation: Thou with the living joyest in the self-bright Ship.

Sanskit Text: शरिये ते पर्श्निरुपसेचनी भूच्छ्रिये दर्विररेपाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śriye te pṛśnirupasecanī bhūcchriye darvirarepāḥ |
Translation: 10 Thy glory was the speckled cup, thy glory was the flawless scoop.

Sanskit Text: यया सवे पात्रे सिञ्चस उत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayā sve pātre siñcasa ut ||
Translation: Wherewith thou pourest into thy receptacle.

Sanskit Text: शतं वा यदसुर्य परति तवा सुमित्र इत्थास्तौद दुर्मित्रैत्थास्तौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ vā yadasurya prati tvā sumitra itthāstaud durmitraitthāstau |
Translation: 11 As hundreds, O Immortal God, have sung to thee, so hath Sumitra, yea, Durmitra praised thee here,

Sanskit Text: आवो यद दस्युहत्ये कुत्सपुत्रं परावो यद्दस्युहत्ये कुत्सवत्सम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvo yad dasyuhatye kutsaputraṃ prāvo yaddasyuhatye kutsavatsam ||
Translation: What time thou holpest Kutsa's son, when Dasyus fell, yea, holpest Kutsa's darling when the Dasyus died.

Sanskit Text: आविरभून महि माघोनमेषां विश्वं जीवं तमसो निरमोचि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvirabhūn mahi māghonameṣāṃ viśvaṃ jīvaṃ tamaso niramoci |
Translation: 1. THESE men's great bounty hath been manifested, and the whole world of life set free from darkness.

Sanskit Text: महि जयोतिः पित्र्भिर्दत्तमागादुरुः पन्थादक्षिणाया अदर्शि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahi jyotiḥ pitṛbhirdattamāghāduruḥ panthādakṣiṇāyā adarśi ||
Translation: Great light hath come, vouchsafed us by the Fathers: apparent is the spacious path of Guerdon.

Sanskit Text: उच्चा दिवि दक्षिणावन्तो अस्थुर्ये अश्वदाः सह तेसूर्येण |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uccā divi dakṣiṇāvanto asthurye aśvadāḥ saha tesūryeṇa |
Translation: 2 High up in heaven abide the Guerdon-givers: they who give steeds dwell with the Sun for ever.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यदा अम्र्तत्वं भजन्ते वासोदाः सोम परतिरन्त आयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyadā amṛtatvaṃ bhajante vāsodāḥ soma pratiranta āyuḥ ||
Translation: They who give gold are blest with life eternal. they who give robes prolong their lives, O Soma.

Sanskit Text: दैवी पूर्तिर्दक्षिणा देवयज्या न कवारिभ्यो नहि तेप्र्णन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: daivī pūrtirdakṣiṇā devayajyā na kavāribhyo nahi tepṛṇanti |
Translation: 3 Not from the niggards-for they give not fireely-comes Meed at sacrifice, Gods’ satisfaction:

Sanskit Text: अथा नरः परयतदक्षिणासो.अवद्यभियाबहवः पर्णन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā naraḥ prayatadakṣiṇāso.avadyabhiyābahavaḥ pṛṇanti ||
Translation: Yea, many men with hands stretched out with Guerdon present their gifts because they dread dishonour.

Sanskit Text: शतधारं वायुमर्कं सवर्विदं नर्चक्षसस्ते अभिचक्षते हविः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śatadhāraṃ vāyumarkaṃ svarvidaṃ nṛcakṣasaste abhicakṣate haviḥ |
Translation: 4 These who observe mankind regard oblation as streamy Vāyu and light-finding Arka.

Sanskit Text: ये पर्णन्ति पर च यछन्ति संगमे तेदक्षिणां दुहते सप्तमातरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye pṛṇanti pra ca yachanti saṃghame tedakṣiṇāṃ duhate saptamātaram ||
Translation: They satisfy and give their gifts in synod, and pour in streams the seven-mothered Guerdon.

Sanskit Text: दक्षिणावान परथमो हूत एति दक्षिणावान गरामणीरग्रमेति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dakṣiṇāvān prathamo hūta eti dakṣiṇāvān ghrāmaṇīraghrameti |
Translation: 5 He who brings Guerdon comes as first invited: chief of the hamlet comes the Guerdon-bearer.

Sanskit Text: तमेव मन्ये नर्पतिं जनानां यः परथमोदक्षिणामाविवाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tameva manye nṛpatiṃ janānāṃ yaḥ prathamodakṣiṇāmāvivāya ||
Translation: Him I account the ruler of the people who was the first to introduce the Guerdon.

Sanskit Text: तमेव रषिं तमु बरह्माणमाहुर्यज्ञन्यं सामगामुक्थशासम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tameva ṛṣiṃ tamu brahmāṇamāhuryajñanyaṃ sāmaghāmukthaśāsam |
Translation: 6 They call him Ṛṣi, Brahman, Sāma-chanter, reciter of the laud, leader of worship.

Sanskit Text: स शुक्रस्य तन्वो वेद तिस्रो यः परथमोदक्षिणया रराध ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa śukrasya tanvo veda tisro yaḥ prathamodakṣiṇayā rarādha ||
Translation: The brightly-shining God's three forms he knoweth who first bestowed the sacrificial Guerdon.

Sanskit Text: दक्षिणाश्वं दक्षिणा गां ददाति दक्षिणा चन्द्रमुत यद धिरण्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dakṣiṇāśvaṃ dakṣiṇā ghāṃ dadāti dakṣiṇā candramuta yad dhiraṇyam |
Translation: 7 Guerdon bestows the horse, bestows the bullock, Guerdon bestows, moreover, gold that Rsisters.

Sanskit Text: दक्षिणान्नं वनुते यो न आत्मादक्षिणां वर्म कर्णुते विजानन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dakṣiṇānnaṃ vanute yo na ātmādakṣiṇāṃ varma kṛṇute vijānan ||
Translation: Guerdon gives food which is our life and spirit. He who is wise takes Guerdon for his armour.

Sanskit Text: न भोजा मम्रुर्न नयर्थमीयुर्न रिष्यन्ति न वयथन्ते हभोजाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na bhojā mamrurna nyarthamīyurna riṣyanti na vyathante habhojāḥ |
Translation: 8 The liberal die not, never are they ruined: the liberal suffer neither harm nor trouble.

Sanskit Text: इदं यद विश्वं भुवनं सवश्चैतत सर्वन्दक्षिणैभ्यो ददाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ yad viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃ svaścaitat sarvandakṣiṇaibhyo dadāti ||
Translation: The light of heaven, the universe about us,—all this doth sacrificial Guerdon give them.

Sanskit Text: भोजा जिग्युः सुरभिं योनिमग्रे भोजा जिग्युर्वध्वं यासुवासाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhojā jighyuḥ surabhiṃ yonimaghre bhojā jighyurvadhvaṃ yāsuvāsāḥ |
Translation: 9 First have the liberal gained a fragrant dwelling, and got themselves a bride in fair apparel.

Sanskit Text: भोजा जिग्युरन्तःपेयं सुराया भोजा जिग्युर्ये अहूताः परयन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhojā jighyurantaḥpeyaṃ surāyā bhojā jighyurye ahūtāḥ prayanti ||
Translation: The liberal have obtained their draught of liquor, and conquered those who, unprovoked, assailed them.

Sanskit Text: भोजायाश्वं सं मर्जन्त्याशुं भोजायास्ते कन्याशुम्भमाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhojāyāśvaṃ saṃ mṛjantyāśuṃ bhojāyāste kanyāśumbhamānā |
Translation: 10 They deck the fleet steed for the bounteous giver: the maid adorns herself and waits to meet him.

Sanskit Text: भोजस्येदं पुष्करिणीव वेश्म परिष्क्र्तन्देवमानेव चित्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhojasyedaṃ puṣkariṇīva veśma pariṣkṛtandevamāneva citram ||
Translation: His home is like a lake with lotus blossoms, like the Gods’ palaces adorned and splendid.

Sanskit Text: भोजमश्वाः सुष्ठुवाहो वहन्ति सुव्र्द रथो वर्ततेदक्षिणायाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhojamaśvāḥ suṣṭhuvāho vahanti suvṛd ratho vartatedakṣiṇāyāḥ |
Translation: 11 Steeds good at draught convey the liberal giver, and lightly rolling moves the car of Guerdon.

Sanskit Text: भोजं देवासो.अवता भरेषु भोजःशत्रून समनीकेषु जेता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhojaṃ devāso.avatā bhareṣu bhojaḥśatrūn samanīkeṣu jetā ||
Translation: Assist, ye Gods, the liberal man in battles: the liberal giver conquers foes in combat.

Sanskit Text: किमिछन्ती सरमा परेदमानड दूरे हयध्वा जगुरिःपराचैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kimichantī saramā predamānaḍ dūre hyadhvā jaghuriḥparācaiḥ |
Translation: 1. WHAT wish of Saramā hath brought her hither? The path leads far away to distant places.

Sanskit Text: कास्मेहितिः का परितक्म्यासीत कथं रसायातरः पयांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kāsmehitiḥ kā paritakmyāsīt kathaṃ rasāyāataraḥ payāṃsi ||
Translation: What charge hast thou for us? Where turns thy journey? How hast thou made thy way o’er Rasā's waters.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य दूतीरिषिता चरामि मह इछन्ती पणयो निधीन्वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya dūtīriṣitā carāmi maha ichantī paṇayo nidhīnvaḥ |
Translation: 2 I come appointed messenger of Indra, seeking your ample stores of wealth, O Paṇis.

Sanskit Text: अतिष्कदो भियसा तन न आवत तथा रसाया अतरम्पयांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atiṣkado bhiyasā tan na āvat tathā rasāyā atarampayāṃsi ||
Translation: This hath preserved me from the fear of crossing: thus have I made my way o’er Rasā's waters.

Sanskit Text: कीद्रंं इन्द्रः सरमे का दर्शीका यस्येदं दूतीरसरः पराकात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kīdṛṃṃ indraḥ sarame kā dṛśīkā yasyedaṃ dūtīrasaraḥ parākāt |
Translation: 3 What is that Indra like, what is his aspect whose envoy, Saramā, from afar thou comest?

Sanskit Text: आ च गछान मित्रमेना दधामाथागवां गोपतिर्नो भवाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ca ghachān mitramenā dadhāmāthāghavāṃ ghopatirno bhavāti ||
Translation: Let him approach, and we will show him friendship: he shall be made the herdsman of our cattle.

Sanskit Text: नाहं तं वेद दभ्यं दभत स यस्येदं दूतीरसरं पराकात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāhaṃ taṃ veda dabhyaṃ dabhat sa yasyedaṃ dūtīrasaraṃ parākāt |
Translation: 4 I know him safe from harm: but he can punish who sent me hither from afar as envoy.

Sanskit Text: न तं गूहन्ति सरवतो गभीरा हतािन्द्रेण पणयः शयध्वे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na taṃ ghūhanti sravato ghabhīrā hatāindreṇa paṇayaḥ śayadhve ||
Translation: Him rivers flowing with deep waters bide not. Low will ye be, O Paṇis, slain by Indra.

Sanskit Text: इमा गावः सरमे या ऐछः परि दिवो अन्तान सुभगेपतन्ती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā ghāvaḥ sarame yā aichaḥ pari divo antān subhaghepatantī |
Translation: 5 These are the kine which, Saramā, thou seekest, flying, O Blest One, to the ends of heaven.

Sanskit Text: कस्त एना अव सर्जादयुध्व्युतास्माकमायुधासन्ति तिग्मा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kasta enā ava sṛjādayudhvyutāsmākamāyudhāsanti tighmā ||
Translation: Who will loose these for thee without a battle? Yea, and sharp-pointed are our warlike weapons.

Sanskit Text: असेन्या वः पणयो वचांस्यनिषव्यास्तन्वः सन्तु पापीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asenyā vaḥ paṇayo vacāṃsyaniṣavyāstanvaḥ santu pāpīḥ |
Translation: 6 Even if your wicked bodies, O ye Paṇis, were arrow-proof, your words are weak for wounding;

Sanskit Text: अध्र्ष्टो व एतवा अस्तु पन्था बर्हस्पतिर्व उभया नम्र्ळात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhṛṣṭo va etavā astu panthā bṛhaspatirva ubhayā namṛḷāt ||
Translation: And were the path to you as yet unmastered, Bṛhaspati in neither case will spare you.

Sanskit Text: अयं निधिः सरमे अद्रिबुध्नो गोभिरश्वेभिर्वसुभिर्न्य्र्ष्टः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ nidhiḥ sarame adribudhno ghobhiraśvebhirvasubhirnyṛṣṭaḥ |
Translation: 7 Paved with the rock is this our treasure-chamber; filled full of precious things, of kine, and horses.

Sanskit Text: रक्षन्ति तं पणयो ये सुगोपा रेकु पदमलकमा जगन्थ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rakṣanti taṃ paṇayo ye sughopā reku padamalakamā jaghantha ||
Translation: These Paṇis who are watchful keepers guard it. In vain hast thou approached this lonely station.

Sanskit Text: एह गमन्न्र्षयः सोमशिता अयास्यो अङगिरसो नवग्वाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: eha ghamannṛṣayaḥ somaśitā ayāsyo aṅghiraso navaghvāḥ |
Translation: 8 Ṛṣis will come inspirited with Soma, Aṅgirases unwearied, and Navagvas.

Sanskit Text: त एतमूर्वं वि भजन्त गोनामथैतद वचः पणयोवमन्नित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ta etamūrvaṃ vi bhajanta ghonāmathaitad vacaḥ paṇayovamannit ||
Translation: This stall of cattle will they part among them: then will the Paṇis wish these words unspoken.

Sanskit Text: एवा च तवं सरम आजगन्थ परबाधिता सहसा दैव्येन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā ca tvaṃ sarama ājaghantha prabādhitā sahasā daivyena |
Translation: 9 Even thus, O Saramā, hast thou come hither, forced by celestial might to make the journey.

Sanskit Text: सवसारं तवा कर्णवै मा पुनर्गा अप ते गवां सुभगेभजाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svasāraṃ tvā kṛṇavai mā punarghā apa te ghavāṃ subhaghebhajāma ||
Translation: Turn thee not back, for thou shalt be our sister: O Blest One, we will give thee of the cattle.

Sanskit Text: नाहं वेद भरात्र्त्वं नो सवस्र्त्वमिन्द्रो विदुरङगिरसश्च घोराः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāhaṃ veda bhrātṛtvaṃ no svasṛtvamindro viduraṅghirasaśca ghorāḥ |
Translation: 10 Brotherhood, sisterhood, I know not either: the dread Aṅgirases and Indra know them.

Sanskit Text: गोकामा मे अछदयन यदायमपात इत पणयोवरीयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghokāmā me achadayan yadāyamapāta ita paṇayovarīyaḥ ||
Translation: They seemed to long for kine when I departed. Hence, into distance, be ye gone, O Paṇis.

Sanskit Text: दूरमित पणयो वरीय उद गावो यन्तु मिनतीरतेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūramita paṇayo varīya ud ghāvo yantu minatīrtena |
Translation: 11 Hence, far away, ye Paṇis! Let the cattle lowing come forth as holy Law commandeth,

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिर्या अविन्दन निगूळाः सोमो गरावाण रषयश्च विप्राः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatiryā avindan nighūḷāḥ somo ghrāvāṇa ṛṣayaśca viprāḥ ||
Translation: Kine which Bṛhaspati, and Soma, Ṛṣis, sages, and pressing-stones have found when hidden.

Sanskit Text: ते.अवदन परथमा बरह्मकिल्बिषे.अकूपारः सलिलोमातरिश्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te.avadan prathamā brahmakilbiṣe.akūpāraḥ salilomātariśvā |
Translation: 1. THESE first, the boundless Sea, and Mātariśvan, fierce-glowing Fire, the Strong, the Bliss-bestower.

Sanskit Text: वीळुहरास्तप उग्रो मयोभूरापो देवीःप्रथमजा रतेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vīḷuharāstapa ughro mayobhūrāpo devīḥprathamajā ṛtena ||
Translation: And heavenly Floods, first-born by holy Order, exclaimed against the outrage on a Brahman.

Sanskit Text: सोमो राजा परथमो बरह्मजायां पुनः परायछदह्र्णीयमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somo rājā prathamo brahmajāyāṃ punaḥ prāyachadahṛṇīyamānaḥ |
Translation: 2 King Soma first of all, without reluctance, made restitution of the Brahman's consort.

Sanskit Text: अन्वर्तिता वरुणो मित्र आसीदग्निर्होताहस्तग्र्ह्या निनाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anvartitā varuṇo mitra āsīdaghnirhotāhastaghṛhyā nināya ||
Translation: Mitra and Varuṇa were the inviters: Agni as Hota; took her hand and led her.

Sanskit Text: हस्तेनैव गराह्य आधिरस्या बरह्मजायेयमिति चेदवोचन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hastenaiva ghrāhya ādhirasyā brahmajāyeyamiti cedavocan |
Translation: 3 The man, her pledge, must by her hand be taken when they have cried, She is a Brahman's consort.

Sanskit Text: न दूताय परह्ये तस्थ एषा तथा राष्ट्रं गुपितंक्षत्रियस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na dūtāya prahye tastha eṣā tathā rāṣṭraṃ ghupitaṃkṣatriyasya ||
Translation: She stayed not for a herald to conduct her: thus is the kingdom of a ruler guarded.

Sanskit Text: देवा एतस्यामवदन्त पूर्वे सप्तर्षयस्तपसे ये निषेदुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devā etasyāmavadanta pūrve saptaṛṣayastapase ye niṣeduḥ |
Translation: 4 Thus spake of her those Gods of old, Seven Ṛṣis who sate them down to their austere devotion:

Sanskit Text: भीमा जाया बराह्मणस्योपनीता दुर्धां दधातिपरमे वयोमन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhīmā jāyā brāhmaṇasyopanītā durdhāṃ dadhātiparame vyoman ||
Translation: Dire is a Brahman's wife led home by others: in the supremest heaven she plants confusion.

Sanskit Text: बरह्मचारी चरति वेविषद विषः स देवानां भवत्येकमङगम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmacārī carati veviṣad viṣaḥ sa devānāṃ bhavatyekamaṅgham |
Translation: 5 The Brahmacari goes engaged in duty: he is a member of the Gods’ own body.

Sanskit Text: तेन जायामन्वविन्दद बर्हस्पतिः सोमेन नीतांजुह्वं न देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tena jāyāmanvavindad bṛhaspatiḥ somena nītāṃjuhvaṃ na devāḥ ||
Translation: Through him Bṛhaspati obtained his consort, as the Gods gained the ladle brought by Soma.

Sanskit Text: पुनर्वै देवा अददुः पुनर्मनुष्या उत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: punarvai devā adaduḥ punarmanuṣyā uta |
Translation: 6 So then the Gods restored her, so men gave the woman back again.

Sanskit Text: राजानःसत्यं कर्ण्वाना बरह्मजायां पुनर्ददुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rājānaḥsatyaṃ kṛṇvānā brahmajāyāṃ punardaduḥ ||
Translation: The Kings who kept their promises restored the Brahman's wedded wife,

Sanskit Text: पुनर्दाय बरह्मजायां कर्त्वी देवैर्निकिल्बिषम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: punardāya brahmajāyāṃ kṛtvī devairnikilbiṣam |
Translation: 7 Having restored the Brahman's wife, and freed them, with Gods’ aid, from sin,

Sanskit Text: ऊर्जम्प्र्थिव्या भक्त्वायोरुगायमुपासते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrjampṛthivyā bhaktvāyorughāyamupāsate ||
Translation: They shared the fulness of the earth, and won themselves extended sway.

Sanskit Text: समिद्धो अद्य मनुषो दुरोणे देवो देवान यजसि जातवेदः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samiddho adya manuṣo duroṇe devo devān yajasi jātavedaḥ |
Translation: 1. THOU in the house of man this day enkindled worshippest Gods as God, O Jātavedas.

Sanskit Text: आ च वह मित्रमहश्चिकित्वान तवं दूतः कविरसिप्रचेताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā ca vaha mitramahaścikitvān tvaṃ dūtaḥ kavirasipracetāḥ ||
Translation: Observant, bright as Mitra, bring them hither: thou art a sapient and foreknowing envoy.

Sanskit Text: तनूनपात पथ रतस्य यानान मध्वा समञ्जन सवदयासुजिह्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tanūnapāt patha ṛtasya yānān madhvā samañjan svadayāsujihva |
Translation: 2 Tanūnapāt, fair-tongued, with sweet meath balming the paths and waysof Order, make them pleasant.

Sanskit Text: मन्मानि धीभिरुत यज्ञं रन्धन देवत्रा चक्र्णुह्यध्वरं नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: manmāni dhībhiruta yajñaṃ ṛndhan devatrā cakṛṇuhyadhvaraṃ naḥ ||
Translation: Convey our sacrifice to heaven, exalting with holy thoughts ourhymns of praise and worship.

Sanskit Text: आजुह्वान ईड्यो वन्द्यश्चा याह्यग्ने वसुभिः सजोषाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ājuhvāna īḍyo vandyaścā yāhyaghne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ |
Translation: 3 Invoked, deserving prayer and adoration, O Agni, come accordant with the Vasus.

Sanskit Text: तवं देवानामसि यह्व होता स एनान यक्षीषितो यजीयान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ devānāmasi yahva hotā sa enān yakṣīṣito yajīyān ||
Translation: Thou art, O Youthful Lord, the Gods’ Invoker, so, best of Sacrificers, bring them quickly.

Sanskit Text: पराचीनं बर्हिः परदिशा पर्थिव्या वस्तोरस्या वर्ज्यतेग्रे अह्नाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prācīnaṃ barhiḥ pradiśā pṛthivyā vastorasyā vṛjyateaghre ahnām |
Translation: 4 By rule the Sacred Grass is scattered eastward, a robe to clothe this earth when dawns are breaking.

Sanskit Text: वयु परथते वितरं वरीयो देवेभ्यो अदितयेस्योनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyu prathate vitaraṃ varīyo devebhyo aditayesyonam ||
Translation: Widely it spreads around and far-extended, fair for the Gods and bringing peace and freedom.

Sanskit Text: वयचस्वतीरुर्विया वि शरयन्तां पतिभ्यो न जनयःशुम्भमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyacasvatīrurviyā vi śrayantāṃ patibhyo na janayaḥśumbhamānāḥ |
Translation: 5 Let the expansive Doors be widely opened, like wives who deck their beauty for their husbands.

Sanskit Text: देवीर्द्वारो बर्हतीर्विश्वमिन्वा देवेभ्योभवत सुप्रायणाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devīrdvāro bṛhatīrviśvaminvā devebhyobhavata suprāyaṇāḥ ||
Translation: Lofty, celestial, all-impelling Portals, admit the Gods and give them easy entrance.

Sanskit Text: आ सुष्वयन्ती यजते उपाके उषासानक्ता सदतां नियोनौ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā suṣvayantī yajate upāke uṣāsānaktā sadatāṃ niyonau |
Translation: 6 Pouring sweet dews let holy Night and Morning, each close to each, he seated at their station,

Sanskit Text: दिव्ये योषणे बर्हती सुरुक्मे अधि शरियंशुक्रपिशं दधाने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divye yoṣaṇe bṛhatī surukme adhi śriyaṃśukrapiśaṃ dadhāne ||
Translation: Lofty, celestial Dames with gold to deck them. assuming all their fair and radiant beauty.

Sanskit Text: दैव्या होतारा परथमा सुवाचा मिमाना यज्ञं मनुषोयजध्यै |
Sanskrit Transliteration: daivyā hotārā prathamā suvācā mimānā yajñaṃ manuṣoyajadhyai |
Translation: 7 Come the two first celestial sweet-voiced Hotars, arranging sacrifice for man to worship

Sanskit Text: परचोदयन्ता विदथेषु कारू पराचीनं जयोतिःप्रदिशा दिशन्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pracodayantā vidatheṣu kārū prācīnaṃ jyotiḥpradiśā diśantā ||
Translation: As singers who inspire us in assemblies, showing the eastward light with their direction.

Sanskit Text: आ नो यज्ञं भारती तूयमेत्विळा मनुष्वदिहचेतयन्ती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no yajñaṃ bhāratī tūyametviḷā manuṣvadihacetayantī |
Translation: 8 Let Bhāratī come quickly to our worship, and Iḷā showing like a human being.

Sanskit Text: तिस्रो देवीर्बर्हिरेदं सयोनं सरस्वतीस्वपसः सदन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisro devīrbarhiredaṃ syonaṃ sarasvatīsvapasaḥ sadantu ||
Translation: So let Sarasvatī and both her fellows, deft Goddesses, on this fair grass be seated.

Sanskit Text: य इमे दयावाप्र्थिवी जनित्री रूपैरपिंशद भुवनानिविश्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya ime dyāvāpṛthivī janitrī rūpairapiṃśad bhuvanāniviśvā |
Translation: 9 Hotar more skilled in sacrifice, bring hither with speed to-day God Tvaṣṭar, thou who knowest.

Sanskit Text: तमद्य होतरिषितो यजीयान देवं तवष्टारमिह यक्षि विद्वान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamadya hotariṣito yajīyān devaṃ tvaṣṭāramiha yakṣi vidvān ||
Translation: Even him who formed these two, the Earth and Heaven the Parents, with their forms, and every creature.

Sanskit Text: उपावस्र्ज तमन्या समञ्जन देवानां पाथ रतुथाहवींषि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upāvasṛja tmanyā samañjan devānāṃ pātha ṛtuthāhavīṃṣi |
Translation: 10 Send to our offerings which thyself thou balmest the Companies of Gods in ordered season.

Sanskit Text: वनस्पतिः शमिता देवो अग्निः सवदन्तु हव्यम्मधुना घर्तेन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vanaspatiḥ śamitā devo aghniḥ svadantu havyammadhunā ghṛtena ||
Translation: Agni, Vanaspati the Immolator sweeten our offered gift with meath and butter.

Sanskit Text: सद्यो जातो वयमिमीत यज्ञमग्निर्देवानामभवत्पुरोगाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadyo jāto vyamimīta yajñamaghnirdevānāmabhavatpuroghāḥ |
Translation: 11 Agni, as soon as he was born, made ready the sacrifice, and was the Gods’ preceder.

Sanskit Text: अस्य होतुः परदिश्य रतस्य वाचि सवाहाक्र्तंहविरदन्तु देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya hotuḥ pradiśy ṛtasya vāci svāhākṛtaṃhaviradantu devāḥ ||
Translation: May the Gods cat our offering consecrated according to this true Priest's voice and guidance.

Sanskit Text: मनीषिणः पर भरध्वं मनीषां यथा-यथा मतयःसन्ति नर्णाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: manīṣiṇaḥ pra bharadhvaṃ manīṣāṃ yathā-yathā matayaḥsanti nṛṇām |
Translation: 1. BRING forth your sacred song ye prudent singers, even as are the thoughts of human beings.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रं सत्यैरेरयामा कर्तेभिः स हिवीरो गिर्वणस्युर्विदानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraṃ satyairerayāmā kṛtebhiḥ sa hivīro ghirvaṇasyurvidānaḥ ||
Translation: Let us draw Indra with true deeds anear us: he loves our songs, the Hero, and is potent.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य हि सदसो धीतिरद्यौत सं गार्ष्टेयो वर्षभोगोभिरानट |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya hi sadaso dhītiradyaut saṃ ghārṣṭeyo vṛṣabhoghobhirānaṭ |
Translation: 2 The hymn shone brightly from the seat of worship: to the kine came the Bull, the Heifer's Offipring

Sanskit Text: उदतिष्ठत तविषेणा रवेण महान्ति चित्सं विव्याचा रजांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: udatiṣṭhat taviṣeṇā raveṇa mahānti citsaṃ vivyācā rajāṃsi ||
Translation: With mighty bellowing hath he arisen, and hath pervaded even the spacious regions.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रः किल शरुत्या अस्य वेद स हि जिष्णुः पथिक्र्त्सूर्याय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraḥ kila śrutyā asya veda sa hi jiṣṇuḥ pathikṛtsūryāya |
Translation: 3 Indra knows, verily, how to hear our singing, for he, victorious, made a path for Sūrya.

Sanskit Text: आन मेनां कर्ण्वन्नच्युतो भुवद गोः पतिर्दिवः सनजा अप्रतीतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ān menāṃ kṛṇvannacyuto bhuvad ghoḥ patirdivaḥ sanajā apratītaḥ ||
Translation: He made the Cow, and be became the Sovran of Heaven, primeval, matchless, and unshaken.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो मह्ना महतो अर्णवस्य वरतामिनादङगिरोभिर्ग्र्णानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro mahnā mahato arṇavasya vratāminādaṅghirobhirghṛṇānaḥ |
Translation: 4 Praised by Aṅgirases, Indra demolished with might the works of the great watery monster

Sanskit Text: पुरूणि चिन नि तताना रजांसि दाधार योधरुणं सत्यताता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purūṇi cin ni tatānā rajāṃsi dādhāra yodharuṇaṃ satyatātā ||
Translation: Full many regions, too, hath he pervaded, and by his truth supported earth's foundation.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो दिवः परतिमानं पर्थिव्या विश्वा वेद सवना हन्तिशुष्णम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro divaḥ pratimānaṃ pṛthivyā viśvā veda savanā hantiśuṣṇam |
Translation: 5 The counterpart of heaven and earth is Indra: he knoweth all libations, slayeth Śuṣṇa.

Sanskit Text: महीं चिद दयामातनोत सूर्येण चास्कम्भ चित्कम्भनेन सकभीयान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahīṃ cid dyāmātanot sūryeṇa cāskambha citkambhanena skabhīyān ||
Translation: The vast sky with the Sun hath he extended, and, best otpillars, stayed it with a pillar.

Sanskit Text: वज्रेण हि वर्त्रहा वर्त्रमस्तरदेवस्य शूशुवानस्यमायाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vajreṇa hi vṛtrahā vṛtramastaradevasya śūśuvānasyamāyāḥ |
Translation: 6 The Vṛtra-slaver with his bolt felled Vṛtra: the magic of the godless, waxen mighty,

Sanskit Text: वि धर्ष्णो अत्र धर्षता जघन्थाथाभवोमघवन बाह्वोजाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi dhṛṣṇo atra dhṛṣatā jaghanthāthābhavomaghavan bāhvojāḥ ||
Translation: Here hast thou, Bold Assailant, boldly conquered. Yea, then thine arms, O Maghavan, were potent.

Sanskit Text: सचन्त यदुषसः सूर्येण चित्रामस्य केतवो रामविन्दन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sacanta yaduṣasaḥ sūryeṇa citrāmasya ketavo rāmavindan |
Translation: 7 When the Dawns come attendant upon Sūrya their rays discover wealth of divers colours.

Sanskit Text: आ यन नक्षत्रं दद्र्शे दिवो न पुनर्यतो नकिरद्धा नु वेद ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yan nakṣatraṃ dadṛśe divo na punaryato nakiraddhā nu veda ||
Translation: The Star of heaven is seen as ’twere approaching: none knoweth aught of it as it departeth.

Sanskit Text: दूरं किल परथमा जग्मुरासामिन्द्रस्य याः परसवेसस्रुरापः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūraṃ kila prathamā jaghmurāsāmindrasya yāḥ prasavesasrurāpaḥ |
Translation: 8 Far have they gone, the first of all these waters, the waters that flowed forth when Indra sent them.

Sanskit Text: कव सविदग्रं कव बुध्न आसामापोमध्यं कव वो नूनमन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kva svidaghraṃ kva budhna āsāmāpomadhyaṃ kva vo nūnamantaḥ ||
Translation: Where is their spring, and where is their foundation? Where now, ye Waters, is your inmost centre?

Sanskit Text: सर्जः सिन्धून्रहिना जग्रसानानादिदेताः पर विविज्रेजवेन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sṛjaḥ sindhūnrahinā jaghrasānānādidetāḥ pra vivijrejavena |
Translation: 9 Thou didst free rivers swallowed by the Dragon; and rapidly they set themselves in motion,

Sanskit Text: मुमुक्षमाणा उत या मुमुच्रे.अधेदेता नरमन्ते नितिक्ताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mumukṣamāṇā uta yā mumucre.adhedetā naramante nitiktāḥ ||
Translation: Those that were loosed and those that longed for freedom. Excited now to speed they run unresting.

Sanskit Text: सध्रीचीः सिन्धुमुशतीरिवायन सनाज्जार आरितःपूर्भिदासाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadhrīcīḥ sindhumuśatīrivāyan sanājjāra āritaḥpūrbhidāsām |
Translation: 10 Yearning together they have sped to Sindhu: the Fort-destroyer, praised, of old, hath loved them.

Sanskit Text: अस्तमा ते पार्थिवा वसून्यस्मे जग्मुःसून्र्ता इन्द्र पूर्वीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: astamā te pārthivā vasūnyasme jaghmuḥsūnṛtā indra pūrvīḥ ||
Translation: Indra, may thy terrestrial treasures reach us, and our full songs of joy approach thy dwelling.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र पिब परतिकामं सुतस्य परातःसावस्तव हिपूर्वपीतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra piba pratikāmaṃ sutasya prātaḥsāvastava hipūrvapītiḥ |
Translation: 1. DRINK of the juice, O Indra, at thy plea. sure, for thy first draught is early morn's libation.

Sanskit Text: हर्षस्व हन्तवे शूर शत्रूनुक्थेभिष टेवीर्या पर बरवाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: harṣasva hantave śūra śatrūnukthebhiṣ ṭevīryā pra bravāma ||
Translation: Rejoice, that thou mayst slay our foes, O Hero, and we with lauds will tell thy mighty exploits.

Sanskit Text: यस्ते रथो मनसो जवीयानेन्द्र तेन सोमपेयाय याहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaste ratho manaso javīyānendra tena somapeyāya yāhi |
Translation: 2 Thou hast a car more swift than thought, O Indra; thercon come hither, come to drink the Soma.

Sanskit Text: तूयमा ते हरयः पर दरवन्तु येभिर्यासि वर्षभिर्मन्दमानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tūyamā te harayaḥ pra dravantu yebhiryāsi vṛṣabhirmandamānaḥ ||
Translation: Let thy Bay Steeds, thy Stallions, hasten hither, with whom thou cornest nigh and art delighted.

Sanskit Text: हरित्वता वर्चसा सूर्यस्य शरेष्ठै रूपैस्तन्वंस्पर्शयस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: haritvatā varcasā sūryasya śreṣṭhai rūpaistanvaṃsparśayasva |
Translation: 3 Deck out thy body with the fairest colours, with golden splendour of the Sun adorn it.

Sanskit Text: अस्माभिरिन्द्र सखिभिर्हुवानः सध्रीचीनोमादयस्वा निषद्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmābhirindra sakhibhirhuvānaḥ sadhrīcīnomādayasvā niṣadya ||
Translation: O Indra, turn thee hitherward invited by us thy friends; be seated and be joyful.

Sanskit Text: यस्य तयत ते महिमानं मदेष्विमे मही रोदसीनाविविक्ताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya tyat te mahimānaṃ madeṣvime mahī rodasīnāviviktām |
Translation: 4 O thou whose grandeur in thy festive transports not even these two great worlds have comprehended.

Sanskit Text: तदोक आ हरिभिरिन्द्र युक्तैः परियेभिर्याहि परियमन्नमछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadoka ā haribhirindra yuktaiḥ priyebhiryāhi priyamannamacha ||
Translation: Come, Indra, with thy dear Bay Horses harnessed, come to our dwelling and the food thou lovest.

Sanskit Text: यस्य शश्वत पपिवानिन्द्र शत्रूननानुक्र्त्या रण्याचकर्थ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya śaśvat papivānindra śatrūnanānukṛtyā raṇyācakartha |
Translation: 5 Pressed for thy joyous banquet is the Soma, Soma whereof thou, Indra, ever drinking,

Sanskit Text: स ते पुरन्धिं तविषीमियर्ति स ते मदायसुत इन्द्र सोमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa te purandhiṃ taviṣīmiyarti sa te madāyasuta indra somaḥ ||
Translation: Hast waged unequalled battles with thy foemen, which prompts the mighty flow of thine abundance.

Sanskit Text: इदं ते पात्रं सनवित्तमिन्द्र पिबा सोममेना शतक्रतो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ te pātraṃ sanavittamindra pibā somamenā śatakrato |
Translation: 6 Found from of old is this thy cup, O Indra: Śatakratu, drink therefrom the Soma.

Sanskit Text: पूर्ण आहावो मदिरस्य मध्वो यं विश्व इदभिहर्यन्तिदेवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrṇa āhāvo madirasya madhvo yaṃ viśva idabhiharyantidevāḥ ||
Translation: Filled is the beaker with the meath that gladdens, the beaker which all Deities delight in.

Sanskit Text: वि हि तवामिन्द्र पुरुधा जनासो हितप्रयसो वर्षभह्वयन्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi hi tvāmindra purudhā janāso hitaprayaso vṛṣabhahvayante |
Translation: 7 From many a side with proffered entertainment the folk are calling thee, O Mighty Indra.

Sanskit Text: अस्माकं ते मधुमत्तमानीमा भुवन सवना तेषुहर्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmākaṃ te madhumattamānīmā bhuvan savanā teṣuharya ||
Translation: These our libations shall for thee be richest in sweet meath: dvink thereof and find them pleasant.

Sanskit Text: पर त इन्द्र पूर्व्याणि पर नूनं वीर्या वोचं परथमाक्र्तानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ta indra pūrvyāṇi pra nūnaṃ vīryā vocaṃ prathamākṛtāni |
Translation: 8 I will declare thy deeds of old, O Indra, the mighty acts which thou hast first accomplished.

Sanskit Text: सतीनमन्युरश्रथायो अद्रिं सुवेदनामक्र्णोर्ब्रह्मणे गाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: satīnamanyuraśrathāyo adriṃ suvedanāmakṛṇorbrahmaṇe ghām ||
Translation: In genuine wrath thou loosenedst the mountain so that the Brahman easily found the cattle.

Sanskit Text: नि षु सीद गणपते गणेषु तवामाहुर्विप्रतमंकवीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni ṣu sīda ghaṇapate ghaṇeṣu tvāmāhurvipratamaṃkavīnām |
Translation: 9 Lord of the hosts, amid our bands be seated: they call thee greatest Sage among the sages.

Sanskit Text: न रते तवत करियते किं चनारे महामर्कंमघवञ्चित्रमर्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na ṛte tvat kriyate kiṃ canāre mahāmarkaṃmaghavañcitramarca ||
Translation: Nothing is done, even far away, without thee: great, wondrous, Maghavan, is the hymn I sing thee.

Sanskit Text: अभिख्या नो मघवन नाधमानान सखे बोधि वसुपतेसखीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhikhyā no maghavan nādhamānān sakhe bodhi vasupatesakhīnām |
Translation: 10 Aim of our eyes be thou, for we implore thee, O Maghavan, Friend of friends and Lord of treasures.

Sanskit Text: रणं कर्धि रणक्र्त सत्यशुष्माभक्ते चिदाभजा राये अस्मान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: raṇaṃ kṛdhi raṇakṛt satyaśuṣmābhakte cidābhajā rāye asmān ||
Translation: Fight, Warrior strong in truth, fight thou the battle: give us our share of undivided riches.

Sanskit Text: तमस्य दयावाप्र्थिवी सचेतसा विश्वेभिर्देवैरनुशुष्ममावताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamasya dyāvāpṛthivī sacetasā viśvebhirdevairanuśuṣmamāvatām |
Translation: 1. THE Heavens and the Earth accordant with all Gods encouraged graciously that vigorous might of his.

Sanskit Text: यदैत कर्ण्वानो महिमानमिन्द्रियम्पीत्वी सोमस्य करतुमानवर्धत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadait kṛṇvāno mahimānamindriyampītvī somasya kratumānavardhata ||
Translation: When he came showing forth his majesty and power, he drank of Soma juice and waxed exceeding strong.

Sanskit Text: तमस्य विष्णुर्महिमानमोजसांशुं दधन्वान मधुनोवि रप्शते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamasya viṣṇurmahimānamojasāṃśuṃ dadhanvān madhunovi rapśate |
Translation: 2 This majesty of his Viṣṇu extols and lauds, making the stalCthat gives the meath flow forth with inight.

Sanskit Text: देवेभिरिन्द्रो मघवा सयावभिर्व्र्त्रंजघन्वानभवद वरेण्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devebhirindro maghavā sayāvabhirvṛtraṃjaghanvānabhavad vareṇyaḥ ||
Translation: When Indra Maghavan with those who followed him had smitten Vṛtra he deserved the choice of Gods.

Sanskit Text: वर्त्रेण यदहिना बिभ्रदायुधा समस्थिथा युधयेशंसमाविदे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛtreṇa yadahinā bibhradāyudhā samasthithā yudhayeśaṃsamāvide |
Translation: 3 When, bearing warlike weapons, fain to win thee praise, thou mettest Vṛtra, yea, the Dragon, for the fight,

Sanskit Text: विश्वे ते अत्र मरुतः सह तमनावर्धन्नुग्र महिमानमिन्द्रियम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve te atra marutaḥ saha tmanāvardhannughra mahimānamindriyam ||
Translation: Then all the Maruts who were gathered with dice there extolled, O Mighty One, thy powerful majesty.

Sanskit Text: जज्ञान एव वयबाधत सप्र्धः परापश्यद वीरो अभिपौंस्यं रणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jajñāna eva vyabādhata spṛdhaḥ prāpaśyad vīro abhipauṃsyaṃ raṇam |
Translation: 4 Soon as he sprang to life he forced asun. der hosts: forward the Hero looked to manly deed and war.

Sanskit Text: अव्र्श्चदद्रिमव सस्यदः सर्जदस्तभ्नान नाकं सवपस्यया पर्थुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avṛścadadrimava sasyadaḥ sṛjadastabhnān nākaṃ svapasyayā pṛthum ||
Translation: He cleft the rock, he let concurrent streams flow forth, and with his skilful art stablished the heavens' wide vault.

Sanskit Text: आदिन्द्रः सत्रा तविषीरपत्यत वरीयो दयावाप्र्थिवीबाधत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādindraḥ satrā taviṣīrapatyata varīyo dyāvāpṛthivīabādhata |
Translation: 5 Indra hath evermore possessed surpassing power: he forced, far from each other, heaven and earth apart.

Sanskit Text: अवाभरद धर्षितो वज्रमायसं शेवं मित्रायवरुणाय दाशुषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avābharad dhṛṣito vajramāyasaṃ śevaṃ mitrāyavaruṇāya dāśuṣe ||
Translation: He hurled impetuous down his iron thunderbolt, a joy to Varuṇa's and Mitra's worshipper.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्यात्र तविषीभ्यो विरप्शिन रघायतो अरंहयन्तमन्यवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasyātra taviṣībhyo virapśina ṛghāyato araṃhayantamanyave |
Translation: 6 Then to the mighty powers of Indra, to his wrath, his the fierce Stormer, loud of voice, they came with speed;

Sanskit Text: वर्त्रं यदुग्रो वयव्र्श्चदोजसापो बिभ्रतन्तमसा परीव्र्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛtraṃ yadughro vyavṛścadojasāpo bibhratantamasā parīvṛtam ||
Translation: What time the Potent One rent Vṛtra with his strength, who held the waters back, whom darkness compassed round.

Sanskit Text: या वीर्याणि परथमानि कर्त्वा महित्वेभिर्यतमानौसमीयतुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā vīryāṇi prathamāni kartvā mahitvebhiryatamānausamīyatuḥ |
Translation: 7 Even in the first of those heroic acts which they who strove together came with might to execute,

Sanskit Text: धवान्तं तमो.अव दध्वसे हत इन्द्रो मह्नापूर्वहूतावपत्यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhvāntaṃ tamo.ava dadhvase hata indro mahnāpūrvahūtāvapatyata ||
Translation: Deep darkness fell upon the slain, and Indra won by victory the right of being first invoked.

Sanskit Text: विश्वे देवासो अध वर्ष्ण्यानि ते.अवर्धयन सोमवत्यावचस्यया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśve devāso adha vṛṣṇyāni te.avardhayan somavatyāvacasyayā |
Translation: 8 Then all the Gods extolled, with eloquence inspired by draughts of Soma juice, thy deeds of manly might.

Sanskit Text: रद्धं वर्त्रमहिमिन्द्रस्य हन्मनाग्निर्नजम्भैस्त्र्ष्वन्नमावयत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: raddhaṃ vṛtramahimindrasya hanmanāghnirnajambhaistṛṣvannamāvayat ||
