Translation: As Agni eats the dry food with his tcetlv, he ate Vṛtra, the Dragon, maimed by Indra's deadly dart.

Sanskit Text: भूरि दक्षेभिर्वचनेभिरकवभिः सख्येभिः सख्यानिप्र वोचत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūri dakṣebhirvacanebhirkvabhiḥ sakhyebhiḥ sakhyānipra vocata |
Translation: 9 Proclaim his many friendships, met with friendship, made with singers, with the skilful and the eloquent.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रो धुनिं च चुमुरिं च दम्भयञ्छ्रद्धामनस्या शर्णुते दभीतये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indro dhuniṃ ca cumuriṃ ca dambhayañchraddhāmanasyā śṛṇute dabhītaye ||
Translation: Indra, when he subdues Dhuni and Cumuri, lists to Dabhīti for his faithful spirit's sake.

Sanskit Text: तवं पुरूण्या भरा सवश्व्या येभिर्मंसै निवचनानिशंसन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ purūṇyā bharā svaśvyā yebhirmaṃsai nivacanāniśaṃsan |
Translation: 10 Give riches manifold with noble horses, to be remembered while my songs address thee.

Sanskit Text: सुगेभिर्विश्वा दुरिता तरेम विदो षु ण उर्वियागाधमद्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sughebhirviśvā duritā tarema vido ṣu ṇa urviyāghādhamadya ||
Translation: May we by easy paths pass all our troubles: find us this day a ford wide and extensive.

Sanskit Text: घर्मा समन्ता तरिव्र्तं वयापतुस्तयोर्जुष्टिम्मातरिश्वा जगाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: gharmā samantā trivṛtaṃ vyāpatustayorjuṣṭimmātariśvā jaghāma |
Translation: 1. Two perfect springs of heat pervade the Threefold, and come for their delight is Mātariśvan.

Sanskit Text: दिवस पयो दिधिषाणा अवेषन विदुर्देवाः सहसामानमर्कम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divas payo didhiṣāṇā aveṣan vidurdevāḥ sahasāmānamarkam ||
Translation: Craving the milk of heaven the Gods are present: well do they know the praisesong and the Sāman.

Sanskit Text: तिस्रो देष्ट्राय निरतीरुपासते दीर्घश्रुतो वि हिजानन्ति वह्नयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tisro deṣṭrāya nirtīrupāsate dīrghaśruto vi hijānanti vahnayaḥ |
Translation: 2 The priests beard far away, as they are ordered, serve the three Nirrtis, for well they know them.

Sanskit Text: तासां नि चिक्युः कवयो निदानम्परेषु या गुह्येषु वरतेषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāsāṃ ni cikyuḥ kavayo nidānampareṣu yā ghuhyeṣu vrateṣu ||
Translation: Sages have traced the cause that first produced them, dwelling in distant and mysterious chambers.

Sanskit Text: चतुष्कपर्दा युवतिः सुपेशा घर्तप्रतीका वयुनानि वस्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: catuṣkapardā yuvatiḥ supeśā ghṛtapratīkā vayunāni vaste |
Translation: 3 The Youthful One, well-shaped, with four locks braided, brightened with oil, puts on the ordinances.

Sanskit Text: तस्यां सुपर्णा वर्षणा नि षेदतुर्यत्र देवा दधिरेभागधेयम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasyāṃ suparṇā vṛṣaṇā ni ṣedaturyatra devā dadhirebhāghadheyam ||
Translation: Two Birds of mighty power are seated near her, there where the Deities receive their portion.

Sanskit Text: एकः सुपर्णः स समुद्रमा विवेष स इदं विश्वम्भुवनं वि चष्टे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ekaḥ suparṇaḥ sa samudramā viveṣa sa idaṃ viśvambhuvanaṃ vi caṣṭe |
Translation: 4 One of these Birds hath passed into the sea of air: thence he looks round and views this universal world.

Sanskit Text: तं पाकेन मनसापश्यमन्तितस्तम्माता रेळि स उ रेळि मातरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ pākena manasāpaśyamantitastammātā reḷi sa u reḷi mātaram ||
Translation: With simple heart I have beheld him from anear: his Mother kisses him and he returns her kiss.

Sanskit Text: सुपर्णं विप्राः कवयो वचोभिरेकं सन्तं बहुधाकल्पयन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suparṇaṃ viprāḥ kavayo vacobhirekaṃ santaṃ bahudhākalpayanti |
Translation: 5 Him with fair wings though only One in nature, wise singers shape, with songs, in many figures.

Sanskit Text: छन्दांसि च दधतो अध्वरेषु गरहान सोमस्यमिमते दवादश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: chandāṃsi ca dadhato adhvareṣu ghrahān somasyamimate dvādaśa ||
Translation: While they at sacrifices fix the metres, they measure out twelve chalices of Soma.

Sanskit Text: षट्त्रिंशांश्च चतुरः कल्पयन्तश्छन्दांसि चदधत आद्वादशम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṣaṭtriṃśāṃśca caturaḥ kalpayantaśchandāṃsi cadadhata ādvādaśam |
Translation: 6 While they arrange the four and six-and-thirty, and duly order, up to twelve, the measures,

Sanskit Text: यज्ञं विमाय कवयो मनीषर्क्सामाभ्यां पर रथं वर्तयन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñaṃ vimāya kavayo manīṣaṛksāmābhyāṃ pra rathaṃ vartayanti ||
Translation: Having disposed the sacrifice thoughtful sages send the Car forward with the Rc and Sāman.

Sanskit Text: चतुर्दशान्ये महिमानो अस्य तं धीरा वाचा पर णयन्तिसप्त |
Sanskrit Transliteration: caturdaśānye mahimāno asya taṃ dhīrā vācā pra ṇayantisapta |
Translation: 7 The Chariot's majesties are fourteen others: seven sages lead it onward with their Voices.

Sanskit Text: आप्नानं तीर्थं क इह पर वोचद येन पथाप्रपिबन्ते सुतस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpnānaṃ tīrthaṃ ka iha pra vocad yena pathāprapibante sutasya ||
Translation: Who will declare to us the ford Apnana, the path whereby they drink first draughts of Soma?

Sanskit Text: सहस्रधा पञ्चदशान्युक्था यावद दयावाप्र्थिवीतावदित तत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasradhā pañcadaśānyukthā yāvad dyāvāpṛthivītāvadit tat |
Translation: 8 The fifteen lauds are in a thousand places that is as vast as heaven and earth in measure.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रधा महिमानः सहस्रं यावद्ब्रह्म विष्ठितं तावती वाक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasradhā mahimānaḥ sahasraṃ yāvadbrahma viṣṭhitaṃ tāvatī vāk ||
Translation: A thousand spots contain the mighty thousand. Vāk spreadeth forth as far as Prayer extendeth.

Sanskit Text: कश्छन्दसां योगमा वेद धीरः को धिष्ण्यां परतिवाचं पपाद |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaśchandasāṃ yoghamā veda dhīraḥ ko dhiṣṇyāṃ prativācaṃ papāda |
Translation: 9 What sage hath learned the metres' application? Who hath gained Vāk, the spirit's aim and object?

Sanskit Text: कं रत्विजामष्टमं शूरमाहुर्हरीिन्द्रस्य नि चिकाय कः सवित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaṃ ṛtvijāmaṣṭamaṃ śūramāhurharīindrasya ni cikāya kaḥ svit ||
Translation: Which ministering priest is called eighth Hero? Who then hath tracked the two Bay Steeds of Indra?

Sanskit Text: भूम्या अन्तं पर्येके चरन्ति रथस्य धूर्षु युक्तासोस्थुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhūmyā antaṃ paryeke caranti rathasya dhūrṣu yuktāsoasthuḥ |
Translation: 10 Yoked to his chariot-pole there stood the Coursers: they only travel round earth's farthest limits.

Sanskit Text: शरमस्य दायं वि भजन्त्येभ्यो यदा यमो भवतिहर्म्ये हितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śramasya dāyaṃ vi bhajantyebhyo yadā yamo bhavatiharmye hitaḥ ||
Translation: These, when their driver in his home is settled, receive the allotted meed of their exertion.

Sanskit Text: चित्र इच्छिशोस्तरुणस्य वक्षथो न यो मातरावप्येतिधातवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: citra icchiśostaruṇasya vakṣatho na yo mātarāvapyetidhātave |
Translation: 1. VERILY wondrous is the tender Youngling's growth who never draweth nigh to drink his Mothers' milk.

Sanskit Text: अनूधा यदि जीजनदधा च नु ववक्ष सद्योमहि दूत्यं चरन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anūdhā yadi jījanadadhā ca nu vavakṣa sadyomahi dūtyaṃ caran ||
Translation: As soon as she who hath no udder bore him, he, faring on his great errand, suddenly grew strong.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्ह नाम धायि दन्नपस्तमः सं यो वना युवतेभस्मना दता |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirha nāma dhāyi dannapastamaḥ saṃ yo vanā yuvatebhasmanā datā |
Translation: 2 Then Agni was his name, most active to bestow, gathering up the trees with his consuming tooth;

Sanskit Text: अभिप्रमुरा जुह्वा सवध्वर इनो नप्रोथमानो यवसे वर्षा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhipramurā juhvā svadhvara ino naprothamāno yavase vṛṣā ||
Translation: Skilled in fair sacrifice, armed with destroying tongue, impetuous as a bull that snorteth in the mead.

Sanskit Text: तं वो विं न दरुषदं देवमन्धस इन्दुं परोथन्तम्प्रवपन्तमर्णवम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ vo viṃ na druṣadaṃ devamandhasa induṃ prothantampravapantamarṇavam |
Translation: 3 Praise him, yourGod who, bird-like, rests upon a tree, scattering drops of juice and pouring forth his flood,

Sanskit Text: आसा वह्निं न शोचिषा विरप्शिनम्महिव्रतं न सरजन्तमध्वनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsā vahniṃ na śociṣā virapśinammahivrataṃ na sarajantamadhvanaḥ ||
Translation: Speaking aloud with flame as with his lips a priest, and broadening his paths like one of high command.

Sanskit Text: वि यस्य ते जरयसानस्याजर धक्षोर्न वाताः परि सन्त्यच्युताः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi yasya te jrayasānasyājara dhakṣorna vātāḥ pari santyacyutāḥ |
Translation: 4 Thou Everlasting, whom, far-striding fain to burn, the winds, uninterrupted, never overcome,

Sanskit Text: आ रण्वासो युयुधयो न सत्वनं तरितंनशन्त पर शिषन्त इष्टये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā raṇvāso yuyudhayo na satvanaṃ tritaṃnaśanta pra śiṣanta iṣṭaye ||
Translation: They have approached, as warriors eager for the fight, heroic Trita, guiding him to gain his wish.

Sanskit Text: स इदग्निः कन्व्वतमः कण्वसखार्यः परस्यान्तरस्यतरुषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa idaghniḥ kanvvatamaḥ kaṇvasakhāryaḥ parasyāntarasyataruṣaḥ |
Translation: 5 This Agni is the best of Kaṇvas, Kaṇvas' Friend, Conqueror of the foe whether afar or near.

Sanskit Text: अग्निः पातु गर्णतो अग्निः सूरीनग्निर्ददातुतेषामवो नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniḥ pātu ghṛṇato aghniḥ sūrīnaghnirdadātuteṣāmavo naḥ ||
Translation: May Agni guard the singers, guard the princes well: may Agni grant to us our princes' gracious help.

Sanskit Text: वाजिन्तमाय सह्यसे सुपित्र्य तर्षु चयवानो अनु जातवेदसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vājintamāya sahyase supitrya tṛṣu cyavāno anu jātavedase |
Translation: 6 Do thou, Supitrya, swiftly following, make thyself the lord of Jātavedas, mightiest of all,

Sanskit Text: अनुद्रे चिद यो धर्षता वरं सते महिन्तमाय धन्वनेदविष्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anudre cid yo dhṛṣatā varaṃ sate mahintamāya dhanvanedaviṣyate ||
Translation: Who surely gives a boon even in thirsty land most powerful, prepared to aid us in the wilds.

Sanskit Text: एवाग्निर्मर्तैः सह सूरिभिर्वसु षटवे सहसः सूनरोन्र्भिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evāghnirmartaiḥ saha sūribhirvasu ṣṭave sahasaḥ sūnaronṛbhiḥ |
Translation: 7 Thus noble Agni with princes and mortal men is lauded, excellent for conquering strength with chiefs,

Sanskit Text: मित्रासो न ये सुधिता रतायवो दयावो न दयुम्नैरभि सन्ति मानुषान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mitrāso na ye sudhitā ṛtāyavo dyāvo na dyumnairabhi santi mānuṣān ||
Translation: Men who are well-disposed as friends and true to Law, even as the heavens in majesty surpass mankind.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्जो नपात सहसावन्निति तवोपस्तुतस्य वन्दते वर्षा वाक |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrjo napāt sahasāvanniti tvopastutasya vandate vṛṣā vāk |
Translation: 8 O Son of Strength, Victorious, with this title Upastuta's most potent voice reveres thee.

Sanskit Text: तवां सतोषाम तवया सुवीरा दराघीय आयुः परतरन्दधानाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ stoṣāma tvayā suvīrā drāghīya āyuḥ pratarandadhānāḥ ||
Translation: Blest with brave sons by thee we will extol thee, and lengthen out the days of our existence.

Sanskit Text: इति तवाग्ने वर्ष्टिहव्यस्य पुत्रा उपस्तुतास रषयो.अवोचन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iti tvāghne vṛṣṭihavyasya putrā upastutāsa ṛṣayo.avocan |
Translation: 9 Thus, Agni, have the sons of Vrstihavya, the Ṛṣis, the Upastutas invoked thee.

Sanskit Text: तांश्च पाहि गर्णतश्च सूरीन वषड वषळ इत्यूर्ध्वासो अनक्षन नमो नम इत्यूर्ध्वासो अनक्षन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāṃśca pāhi ghṛṇataśca sūrīn vaṣaḍ vaṣaḷ ityūrdhvāso anakṣan namo nama ityūrdhvāso anakṣan ||
Translation: Protect them, guard the singers and the princes. With Vaṣaṭ! have they come, with hands uplifted, with their uplifted hands and cries of Glory!

Sanskit Text: पिबा सोमं महत इन्द्रियाय पिबा वर्त्राय हन्तवेशविष्ठ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pibā somaṃ mahata indriyāya pibā vṛtrāya hantaveśaviṣṭha |
Translation: 1. DRINK Soma juice for mighty power and vigour, drink, Strongest One, that thou mayst smite down Vṛtra.

Sanskit Text: पिब राये शवसे हूयमानः पिब मध्वस्त्र्पदिन्द्रा वर्षस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: piba rāye śavase hūyamānaḥ piba madhvastṛpadindrā vṛṣasva ||
Translation: Drink thou, invoked, for strength, and riches: drink thou thy fill of meath and pour it down, O Indra.

Sanskit Text: अस्य पिब कषुमतः परस्थितस्येन्द्र सोमस्य वरमासुतश्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya piba kṣumataḥ prasthitasyendra somasya varamāsutaśya |
Translation: 2 Drink of the foodful juice stirred into motion, drink what thou choosest of the flowing Soma.

Sanskit Text: सवस्तिदा मनसा मादयस्वार्वाचीनो रेवतेसौभगाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svastidā manasā mādayasvārvācīno revatesaubhaghāya ||
Translation: Giver of weal, be joyful in thy spirit, and turn thee hitherward to bless and prosper.

Sanskit Text: ममत्तु तवा दिव्यः सोम इन्द्र ममत्तु यः सूयतेपार्थिवेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mamattu tvā divyaḥ soma indra mamattu yaḥ sūyatepārthiveṣu |
Translation: 3 Let heavenly Soma gladden thee, O Indra, let that effused among mankind delight thee.

Sanskit Text: ममत्तु येन वरिवश्चकर्थ ममत्तु येननिरिणासि शत्रून ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mamattu yena varivaścakartha mamattu yenaniriṇāsi śatrūn ||
Translation: Rejoice in that whereby thou gavest freedom, and that whereby thou conquerest thy foemen.

Sanskit Text: आ दविबर्हा अमिनो यात्विन्द्रो वर्षा हरिभ्यां परिषिक्तमन्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā dvibarhā amino yātvindro vṛṣā haribhyāṃ pariṣiktamandhaḥ |
Translation: 4 Let Indra come, impetuous, doubly mighty, to the poured juice, the Bull, with two Bay Coursers.

Sanskit Text: गव्या सुतस्य परभ्र्तस्य मध्वः सत्रा खेदामरुशहा वर्षस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghavyā sutasya prabhṛtasya madhvaḥ satrā khedāmaruśahā vṛṣasva ||
Translation: With juices pressed in milk, with meath presented, glut evermore thy bolt, O Foe-destroyer.

Sanskit Text: नि तिग्मानि भराशयन भराश्यान्यव सथिरा तनुहियातुजूनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni tighmāni bhrāśayan bhrāśyānyava sthirā tanuhiyātujūnām |
Translation: 5 Dash down, outffaming their sharp flaming weapons, the strong-holds of the men urged on by demons.

Sanskit Text: उग्राय ते सहो बलं ददामि परतीत्याशत्रून विगदेषु वर्श्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughrāya te saho balaṃ dadāmi pratītyāśatrūn vighadeṣu vṛśca ||
Translation: I give thee, Mighty One, great strength and conquest: go, meet thy foes and rend them in the battle.

Sanskit Text: वयर्य इन्द्र तनुहि शरवांस्योज सथिरेव धन्वनोऽभिमातीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyarya indra tanuhi śravāṃsyoja sthireva dhanvano'bhimātīḥ |
Translation: 6 Extend afar the votary's fame and glory, as the firm archer's strength drives off the foeman.

Sanskit Text: अस्मद्र्यग वाव्र्धानः सहोभिरनिभ्र्ष्टस्तन्वं वाव्र्धस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmadryagh vāvṛdhānaḥ sahobhiranibhṛṣṭastanvaṃ vāvṛdhasva ||
Translation: Ranged on our side, grown strong in might that conquers, never defeated, still increase thy body.

Sanskit Text: इदं हविर्मघवन तुभ्यं रातं परति सम्राळ अह्र्णानोग्र्भाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ havirmaghavan tubhyaṃ rātaṃ prati samrāḷ ahṛṇānoghṛbhāya |
Translation: 7 To thee have we presented this oblation: accept it, Sovran Ruler, free from anger.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्यं सुतो मघवन तुभ्यं पक्वो.अद्धीन्द्र पिबच परस्थितस्य ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyaṃ suto maghavan tubhyaṃ pakvo.addhīndra pibaca prasthitasya ||
Translation: Juice, Maghavan, for thee is pressed and ripened: eat, Indra, drink of that which stirs to meet thee.

Sanskit Text: अद्धीदिन्द्र परस्थितेमा हवींषि चनो दधिष्व पचतोतसोमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: addhīdindra prasthitemā havīṃṣi cano dadhiṣva pacatotasomam |
Translation: 8 Eat, Indra, these oblations which approach thee: be pleased with food made ready and with Soma.

Sanskit Text: परयस्वन्तः परति हर्यामसि तवा सत्याः सन्तुयजमानस्य कामाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prayasvantaḥ prati haryāmasi tvā satyāḥ santuyajamānasya kāmāḥ ||
Translation: With entertainment we receive thee friendly: effectual be the sacrificer's wishes.

Sanskit Text: परेन्द्राग्निभ्यां सुवचस्यामियर्मि सिन्धाविव परेरयंनावमर्कैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prendrāghnibhyāṃ suvacasyāmiyarmi sindhāviva prerayaṃnāvamarkaiḥ |
Translation: 9 I send sweet speech to Indra and to Agni: with hymns I speed it like a boat through waters.

Sanskit Text: अया इव परि चरन्ति देवा ये अस्मभ्यन्धनदा उद्भिदश्च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayā iva pari caranti devā ye asmabhyandhanadā udbhidaśca ||
Translation: Even thus, the Gods seem moving round about me, the fountains and bestowers of our riches.

Sanskit Text: न वा उ देवाः कषुधमिद वधं ददुरुताशितमुपगछन्ति मर्त्यवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na vā u devāḥ kṣudhamid vadhaṃ dadurutāśitamupaghachanti mṛtyavaḥ |
Translation: 1. THE Gods have not ordained hunger to be our death: even to the well-fed man comes death in varied shape.

Sanskit Text: उतो रयिः पर्णतो नोप दस्यत्युताप्र्णन्मर्डितारं न विन्दते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto rayiḥ pṛṇato nopa dasyatyutāpṛṇanmarḍitāraṃ na vindate ||
Translation: The riches of the liberal never waste away, while he who will not give finds none to comfort him.

Sanskit Text: य आध्राय चकमानाय पित्वो.अन्नवान सन्रफितायोपजग्मुषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya ādhrāya cakamānāya pitvo.annavān sanraphitāyopajaghmuṣe |
Translation: 2 The man with food in store who, when the needy comes in miserable case begging for bread to eat,

Sanskit Text: सथिरं मनः कर्णुते सेवते पुरोतोचित स मर्डितारं न विन्दते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sthiraṃ manaḥ kṛṇute sevate purotocit sa marḍitāraṃ na vindate ||
Translation: Hardens his heart against him-even when of old he did him service-finds not one to comfort him.

Sanskit Text: स इद भोजो यो गर्हवे ददात्यन्नकामाय चरते कर्शाय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa id bhojo yo ghṛhave dadātyannakāmāya carate kṛśāya |
Translation: 3 Bounteous is he who gives unto the beggar who comes to him in want of food and feeble.

Sanskit Text: अरमस्मै भवति यामहूता उतापरीषु कर्णुते सखायम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aramasmai bhavati yāmahūtā utāparīṣu kṛṇute sakhāyam ||
Translation: Success attends him in the shout of battle. He makes a friend of him in future troubles.

Sanskit Text: न स सखा यो न ददाति सख्ये सचाभुवे सचमानायपित्वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na sa sakhā yo na dadāti sakhye sacābhuve sacamānāyapitvaḥ |
Translation: 4 No friend is he who to his friend and comrade who comes imploring food, will offer nothing.

Sanskit Text: अपास्मात परेयान न तदोको अस्ति पर्णन्तमन्यमरणं चिदिचःेत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāsmāt preyān na tadoko asti pṛṇantamanyamaraṇaṃ cidicḥet ||
Translation: Let him depart-no home is that to rest in-, and rather seek a stranger to support him.

Sanskit Text: पर्णीयादिन नाधमानाय तव्यान दराघीयांसमनुपश्येत पन्थाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pṛṇīyādin nādhamānāya tavyān drāghīyāṃsamanupaśyeta panthām |
Translation: 5 Let the rich satisfy the poor implorer, and bend his eye upon a longer pathway.

Sanskit Text: ओ हि वर्तन्ते रथ्येव चक्रान्यम-अन्यमुप तिष्ठन्त रायः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: o hi vartante rathyeva cakrānyam-anyamupa tiṣṭhanta rāyaḥ ||
Translation: Riches come now to one, now to another, and like the wheels of cars are ever rolling.

Sanskit Text: मोघमन्नं विन्दते अप्रचेताः सत्यं बरवीमि वध इत सतस्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: moghamannaṃ vindate apracetāḥ satyaṃ bravīmi vadha it satasya |
Translation: 6 The foolish man wins food with fruitless labour: that food -I speak the truth- shall be his ruin.

Sanskit Text: नार्यमणं पुष्यति नो सखायं केवलाघो भवतिकेवलादी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāryamaṇaṃ puṣyati no sakhāyaṃ kevalāgho bhavatikevalādī ||
Translation: He feeds no trusty friend, no man to love him. All guilt is he who eats with no partaker.

Sanskit Text: कर्षन्नित फाल आशितं कर्णोति यन्नध्वानमप वर्ङकतेचरित्रैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṛṣannit phāla āśitaṃ kṛṇoti yannadhvānamapa vṛṅktecaritraiḥ |
Translation: 7 The ploughshare ploughing makes the food that feeds us, and with its feet cuts through the path it follows.

Sanskit Text: वदन बरह्मावदतो वनीयान पर्णन्नापिरप्र्णन्तमभि षयात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vadan brahmāvadato vanīyān pṛṇannāpirapṛṇantamabhi ṣyāt ||
Translation: Better the speaking than the silent Brahman: the liberal friend outyalues him who gives not.

Sanskit Text: एकपाद भूयो दविपदो वि चक्रमे दविपात तरिपादमभ्येतिपश्चात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ekapād bhūyo dvipado vi cakrame dvipāt tripādamabhyetipaścāt |
Translation: 8 He with one foot hath far outrun the biped, and the two-footed catches the three-footed.

Sanskit Text: चतुष्पादेति दविपदामभिस्वरे सम्पश्यन्पङकतीरुपतिष्ठमानः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: catuṣpādeti dvipadāmabhisvare sampaśyanpaṅktīrupatiṣṭhamānaḥ ||
Translation: Four-footed creatures come when bipeds call them, and stand and look where five are met together.

Sanskit Text: समौ चिद धस्तौ न समं विविष्टः सम्मातरा चिन नसमं दुहाते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samau cid dhastau na samaṃ viviṣṭaḥ sammātarā cin nasamaṃ duhāte |
Translation: 9 The hands are both alike: their labour differs. The yield of sister milch-kine is unequal.

Sanskit Text: यमयोश्चिन न समा वीर्याणि जञाती चित्सन्तौ न समं पर्णीतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yamayościn na samā vīryāṇi jñātī citsantau na samaṃ pṛṇītaḥ ||
Translation: Twins even diffier in their strength and vigour: two, even kinsmen, differ in their bounty.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने हंसि नयत्रिणं दीद्यन मर्त्येष्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne haṃsi nyatriṇaṃ dīdyan martyeṣvā |
Translation: 1. AGNI, refulgent among men thou slayest the devouring fiend,

Sanskit Text: सवे कषयेशुचिव्रत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sve kṣayeśucivrata ||
Translation: Bright Ruler in thine own abode.

Sanskit Text: उत तिष्ठसि सवाहुतो घर्तानि परति मोदसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut tiṣṭhasi svāhuto ghṛtāni prati modase |
Translation: 2 Thou springest up when worshipped well the drops of butter are thy joy

Sanskit Text: यत तवा सरुचःसमस्थिरन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat tvā srucaḥsamasthiran ||
Translation: When ladies are brought near to thee.

Sanskit Text: स आहुतो वि रोचते.अग्निरीळेन्यो गिरा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa āhuto vi rocate.aghnirīḷenyo ghirā |
Translation: 3 Honoured with gifts he shines afar, Agni adorable with song:

Sanskit Text: सरुचा परतीकमज्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: srucā pratīkamajyate ||
Translation: The dripping ladle balms his face.

Sanskit Text: घर्तेनाग्निः समज्यते मधुप्रतीक आहुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtenāghniḥ samajyate madhupratīka āhutaḥ |
Translation: 4 Agni with honey in his mouth, honoured with gifts, is balmed with oil,

Sanskit Text: रोचमानोविभावसुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rocamānovibhāvasuḥ ||
Translation: Refulgent in his wealth of light.

Sanskit Text: जरमाणः समिध्यसे देवेभ्यो हव्यवाहन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jaramāṇaḥ samidhyase devebhyo havyavāhana |
Translation: 5 Praised by our hymns thou kindlest thee, Oblation-bearer, for the Gods

Sanskit Text: तं तवा हवन्तमर्त्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā havantamartyāḥ ||
Translation: As such do mortals call on thee.

Sanskit Text: तं मर्ता अमर्त्यं घर्तेनाग्निं सपर्यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ martā amartyaṃ ghṛtenāghniṃ saparyata |
Translation: 6 To that Immortal Agni pay worship with oil, ye mortal men,—

Sanskit Text: अदाभ्यंग्र्हपतिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adābhyaṃghṛhapatim ||
Translation: Lord of the house, whom none deceives.

Sanskit Text: अदाभ्येन शोचिषाग्ने रक्षस्त्वं दह |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adābhyena śociṣāghne rakṣastvaṃ daha |
Translation: 7 O Agni, burn the Rākṣasas with thine unconquerable flame

Sanskit Text: गोपा रतस्यदीदिहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghopā ṛtasyadīdihi ||
Translation: Shine guardian of Eternal Law.

Sanskit Text: स तवमग्ने परतीकेन परत्योष यातुधान्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa tvamaghne pratīkena pratyoṣa yātudhānyaḥ |
Translation: 8 So, Agni, with thy glowing face burn fierce against the female fiends,

Sanskit Text: उरुक्षयेषुदीद्यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: urukṣayeṣudīdyat ||
Translation: Shining among Uruksayas.

Sanskit Text: तं तवा गीर्भिरुरुक्षया हव्यवाहं समीधिरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tvā ghīrbhirurukṣayā havyavāhaṃ samīdhire |
Translation: 9 Uruksayas have kindled thee, Oblation-bearer, thee, with hymns.

Sanskit Text: यजिष्ठं मानुषे जने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajiṣṭhaṃ mānuṣe jane ||
Translation: Best Worshipper among mankind.

Sanskit Text: इति वा इति मे मनो गामश्वं सनुयामिति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iti vā iti me mano ghāmaśvaṃ sanuyāmiti |
Translation: 1. THIS, even this was my resolve, to win a cow, to win a steed:

Sanskit Text: कुवित्सोमस्यापामिति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvitsomasyāpāmiti ||
Translation: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

Sanskit Text: पर वाता इव दोधत उन मा पीता अयंसत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vātā iva dodhata un mā pītā ayaṃsata |
Translation: 2 Like violent gusts of wind the draughts that I have drunk have lifted me

Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvit ... ||
Translation: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

Sanskit Text: उन मा पीता अयंसत रथमश्वा इवाशवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: un mā pītā ayaṃsata rathamaśvā ivāśavaḥ |
Translation: 3 The draughts I drank have borne me up, as fleet-foot horses draw a car:

Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvit ... ||
Translation: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

Sanskit Text: उप मा मतिरस्थित वाश्रा पुत्रमिव परियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa mā matirasthita vāśrā putramiva priyam |
Translation: 4 The hymn hath reached me, like a cow who lows to meet her darling calf:

Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvit ... ||
Translation: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

Sanskit Text: अहं तष्टेव वन्धुरं पर्यचामि हर्दा मतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ taṣṭeva vandhuraṃ paryacāmi hṛdā matim |
Translation: 5 As a wright bends a chariot-seat so round my heart I bend the hymn:

Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvit ... ||
Translation: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

Sanskit Text: नहि मे अक्षिपच्चनाछान्त्सुः पञ्च कर्ष्टयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi me akṣipaccanāchāntsuḥ pañca kṛṣṭayaḥ |
Translation: 6 Not as a mote within the eye count the Five Tribes of men with me:

Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvit ... ||
Translation: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

Sanskit Text: नहि मे रोदसी उभे अन्यं पक्षं चन परति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi me rodasī ubhe anyaṃ pakṣaṃ cana prati |
Translation: 7 The heavens and earth themselves have not grown equal to one half of me

Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvit ... ||
Translation: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

Sanskit Text: अभि दयां महिना भुवमभीमां पर्थिवीं महीम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi dyāṃ mahinā bhuvamabhīmāṃ pṛthivīṃ mahīm |
Translation: 8 I in my grandeur have surpassed the heavens and all this spacious earth

Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvit... ||
Translation: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

Sanskit Text: हन्ताहं पर्थिवीमिमां नि दधानीह वेह वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hantāhaṃ pṛthivīmimāṃ ni dadhānīha veha vā |
Translation: 9 Aha! this spacious earth will I deposit either here or there

Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvit ... ||
Translation: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

Sanskit Text: ओषमित पर्थिवीमहं जङघनानीह वेह वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: oṣamit pṛthivīmahaṃ jaṅghanānīha veha vā |
Translation: 10 In one short moment will I smite the earth in fury here or there:

Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvit ... ||
Translation: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

Sanskit Text: दिवि मे अन्यः पक्षो.अधो अन्यमचीक्र्षम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: divi me anyaḥ pakṣo.adho anyamacīkṛṣam |
Translation: 11 One of my flanks is in the sky; I let the other trail below:

Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvit ... ||
Translation: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

Sanskit Text: अहमस्मि महामहो.अभिनभ्यमुदीषितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahamasmi mahāmaho.abhinabhyamudīṣitaḥ |
Translation: 12 1, greatest of the Mighty Ones, am lifted to the firmament:

Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvit ... ||
Translation: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

Sanskit Text: गर्हो याम्यरंक्र्तो देवेभ्यो हव्यवाहनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛho yāmyaraṃkṛto devebhyo havyavāhanaḥ |
Translation: 13 I seek the worshipper's abode; oblation-bearer to the Gods:

Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvit ... ||
Translation: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

Sanskit Text: तदिदास भुवनेषु जयेष्ठं यतो जज्ञ उग्रस्त्वेषन्र्म्णः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadidāsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭhaṃ yato jajña ughrastveṣanṛmṇaḥ |
Translation: 1. IN all the worlds That was the Best and Highest whence sprang the Mighty Gods, of splendid valour.

Sanskit Text: सद्यो जज्ञानो नि रिणाति शत्रूननु यंविश्वे मदन्त्यूमाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadyo jajñāno ni riṇāti śatrūnanu yaṃviśve madantyūmāḥ ||
Translation: As soon as born he overcomes his foemen, be in whom all who lend him aid are joyful.

Sanskit Text: वाव्र्धानः शवसा भूर्योजाः शत्रुर्दासाय भियसन्दधाति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāvṛdhānaḥ śavasā bhūryojāḥ śatrurdāsāya bhiyasandadhāti |
Translation: 2 Grown mighty in his strength, with ample vigour, he as a foe strikes fear into the Dāsa,

Sanskit Text: अव्यनच्च वयनच्च सस्नि सं ते नवन्त परभ्र्तामदेषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avyanacca vyanacca sasni saṃ te navanta prabhṛtāmadeṣu ||
Translation: Eager to win the breathing and the breathless. All sang thy praise at banquet and oblation.

Sanskit Text: तवे करतुमपि वर्ञ्जन्ति विश्वे दविर्यदेते तरिर्भवन्त्यूमाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve kratumapi vṛñjanti viśve dviryadete trirbhavantyūmāḥ |
Translation: 3 All concentrate on thee their mental vigour, what time these, twice or thrice, are thine assistants.

Sanskit Text: सवादोः सवादीयः सवादुना सर्जा समदः सुमधु मधुनाभि योधीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svādoḥ svādīyaḥ svādunā sṛjā samadaḥ sumadhu madhunābhi yodhīḥ ||
Translation: Blend what is sweeter than the sweet with sweetness: win. quickly with our meath that meath in battle.

Sanskit Text: इति चिद धि तवा धना जयन्तं मदे-मदे अनुमदन्ति विप्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iti cid dhi tvā dhanā jayantaṃ made-made anumadanti viprāḥ |
Translation: 4 Therefore in thee too, thou who winnest riches, at every banquet are the sages joyful.

Sanskit Text: ओजीयो धर्ष्णो सथिरमा तनुष्व मा तवा दभन्यातुधाना दुरेवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ojīyo dhṛṣṇo sthiramā tanuṣva mā tvā dabhanyātudhānā durevāḥ ||
Translation: With mightier power, Bold God, extend thy firmness: let not malignant Yātudhānas harm thee.

Sanskit Text: तवया वयं शाशद्महे रणेषु परपश्यन्तो युधेन्यानिभूरि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvayā vayaṃ śāśadmahe raṇeṣu prapaśyanto yudhenyānibhūri |
Translation: 5 Proudly we put our trust in thee in battles, when we behold great wealth the prize of combat.

Sanskit Text: चोदयामि त आयुधा वचोभिः सं ते शिशामिब्रह्मणा वयांसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: codayāmi ta āyudhā vacobhiḥ saṃ te śiśāmibrahmaṇā vayāṃsi ||
Translation: I with my words impel thy weapons onward, and sharpen with my prayer thy vital vigour.

Sanskit Text: सतुषेय्यं पुरुवर्पसं रभ्वमिनतममाप्त्यमाप्त्यानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: stuṣeyyaṃ puruvarpasaṃ ṛbhvaminatamamāptyamāptyānām |
Translation: 6 Worthy of praises, many-shaped, most skilful, most energetic, Āptya of the Aptyas:

Sanskit Text: आ दर्षते शवसा सप्त दानून पर साक्षते परतिमानानिभूरि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā darṣate śavasā sapta dānūn pra sākṣate pratimānānibhūri ||
Translation: He with his might destroys the seven Danus, subduing many who were deemed his equals.

Sanskit Text: नि तद दधिषे.अवरं परं च यस्मिन्नाविथावसा दुरोणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni tad dadhiṣe.avaraṃ paraṃ ca yasminnāvithāvasā duroṇe |
Translation: 7 Thou in that house which thy protection guardeth bestowest wealth, the higher and the lower.

Sanskit Text: आ मातरा सथापयसे जिगत्नू अत इनोषि कर्वरा पुरूणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā mātarā sthāpayase jighatnū ata inoṣi karvarā purūṇi ||
Translation: Thou stablishest the two much-wandering Mothers, and bringest many deeds to their completion.

Sanskit Text: इमा बरह्म बर्हद्दिवो विवक्तीन्द्राय शूषमग्रियःस्वर्षाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā brahma bṛhaddivo vivaktīndrāya śūṣamaghriyaḥsvarṣāḥ |
Translation: 8 Brhaddiva, the foremost of light-winners, repeats these holy prayers, this strength of Indra.

Sanskit Text: महो गोत्रस्य कषयति सवराजो दुरश्च विश्वाव्र्णोदप सवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: maho ghotrasya kṣayati svarājo duraśca viśvāavṛṇodapa svāḥ ||
Translation: He rules the great self-luminous fold of cattle, and all the doors of light hath he thrown open.

Sanskit Text: एवा महान बर्हद्दिवो अथर्वावोचत सवां तन्वमिन्द्रमेव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā mahān bṛhaddivo atharvāvocat svāṃ tanvamindrameva |
Translation: 9 Thus hath Brhaddiva, the great Atharvan, spoken to Indra as himself in person.

Sanskit Text: सवसारो मातरिभ्वरीररिप्रा हिन्वन्ति च शवसावर्धयन्ति च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svasāro mātaribhvarīrariprā hinvanti ca śavasāvardhayanti ca ||
Translation: The spotless Sisters, they who are his Mothers, with power exalt him and impel him onward.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यगर्भः समवर्तताग्रे भूतस्य जातः पतिरेकासीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyagharbhaḥ samavartatāghre bhūtasya jātaḥ patirekaāsīt |
Translation: 1. IN the beginning rose Hiranyagarbha, born Only Lord of all created beings.

Sanskit Text: स दाधार पर्थिवीं दयामुतेमां कस्मै देवायहविषा विधेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa dādhāra pṛthivīṃ dyāmutemāṃ kasmai devāyahaviṣā vidhema ||
Translation: He fixed and holdeth up this earth and heaven. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

Sanskit Text: य आत्मदा बलदा यस्य विश्व उपासते परशिषं यस्यदेवाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya ātmadā baladā yasya viśva upāsate praśiṣaṃ yasyadevāḥ |
Translation: 2 Giver of vital breath, of power and vigour, he whose commandments all the Gods acknowledge -.

Sanskit Text: यस्य छायाम्र्तं यस्य मर्त्युः कस्मै देवायहविषा विधेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya chāyāmṛtaṃ yasya mṛtyuḥ kasmai devāyahaviṣā vidhema ||
Translation: The Lord of death, whose shade is life immortal. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

Sanskit Text: यः पराणतो निमिषतो महित्वैक इद राजा जगतो बभूव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ prāṇato nimiṣato mahitvaika id rājā jaghato babhūva |
Translation: 3 Who by his grandeur hath become Sole Ruler of all the moving world that breathes and slumbers;

Sanskit Text: य ईशे अस्य दविपदश्चतुष्पदः कस्मै देवाय हविषाविधेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya īśe asya dvipadaścatuṣpadaḥ kasmai devāya haviṣāvidhema ||
Translation: He who is Loord of men and Lord of cattle. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

Sanskit Text: यस्येमे हिमवन्तो महित्वा यस्य समुद्रं रसया सहाहुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasyeme himavanto mahitvā yasya samudraṃ rasayā sahāhuḥ |
Translation: 4 His, through his might, are these snow-covered mountains, and men call sea and Rasā his possession:

Sanskit Text: यस्येमाः परदिशो यस्य बाहू कस्मै देवाय हविषाविधेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasyemāḥ pradiśo yasya bāhū kasmai devāya haviṣāvidhema ||
Translation: His arms are these, his are these heavenly regions. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

Sanskit Text: येन दयौरुग्रा पर्थिवी च दर्ळ्हा येन सव सतभितं येननाकः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yena dyaurughrā pṛthivī ca dṛḷhā yena sva stabhitaṃ yenanākaḥ |
Translation: 5 By him the heavens are strong and earth is stedfast, by him light's realm and sky-vault are supported:

Sanskit Text: यो अन्तरिक्षे रजसो विमानः कस्मै देवायहविषा विधेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo antarikṣe rajaso vimānaḥ kasmai devāyahaviṣā vidhema ||
Translation: By him the regions in mid-air were measured. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

Sanskit Text: यं करन्दसी अवसा तस्तभाने अभ्यैक्षेतां मनसारेजमाने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ krandasī avasā tastabhāne abhyaikṣetāṃ manasārejamāne |
Translation: 6 To him, supported by his help, two armies embattled look while trembling in their spirit,

Sanskit Text: यत्राधि सूर उदितो विभाति कस्मै देवायहविषा विधेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatrādhi sūra udito vibhāti kasmai devāyahaviṣā vidhema ||
Translation: When over them the risen Sun is shining. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

Sanskit Text: आपो ह यद बर्हतीर्विश्वमायन गर्भं दधानाजनयन्तीरग्निम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpo ha yad bṛhatīrviśvamāyan gharbhaṃ dadhānājanayantīraghnim |
Translation: 7 What time the mighty waters came, containing the universal germ, producing Agni,

Sanskit Text: ततो देवानां समवर्ततासुरेकःकस्मै देवाय हविषा विधेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tato devānāṃ samavartatāsurekaḥkasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema ||
Translation: Thence sprang the Gods’ one spirit into being. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

Sanskit Text: यश्चिदापो महिना पर्यपश्यद दक्षं दधानाजनयन्तीर्यज्ञम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaścidāpo mahinā paryapaśyad dakṣaṃ dadhānājanayantīryajñam |
Translation: 8 He in his might surveyed the floods containing productive force and generating Worship.

Sanskit Text: यो देवेष्वधि देव एक आसीत कस्मैदेवाय हविषा विधेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo deveṣvadhi deva eka āsīt kasmaidevāya haviṣā vidhema ||
Translation: He is the God of gods, and none beside him. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

Sanskit Text: मा नो हिंसीज्जनिता यः पर्थिव्या यो वा दिवंसत्यधर्मा जजान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā no hiṃsījjanitā yaḥ pṛthivyā yo vā divaṃsatyadharmā jajāna |
Translation: 9 Neer may he harm us who is earth's Begetter, nor he whose laws are sure, the heavens' Creator,

Sanskit Text: यश्चापश्चन्द्रा बर्हतीर्जजानकस्मै देवाय हविषा विधेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaścāpaścandrā bṛhatīrjajānakasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema ||
Translation: He who brought forth the great and lucid waters. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

Sanskit Text: परजापते न तवदेतान्यन्यो विश्वा जातानि परि ताबभूव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prajāpate na tvadetānyanyo viśvā jātāni pari tābabhūva |
Translation: 10 Prajāpati! thou only comprehendest all these created things, and none beside thee.

Sanskit Text: यत्कामास्ते जुहुमस्तन नो अस्तु वयं सयाम पतयोरयीणाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatkāmāste juhumastan no astu vayaṃ syāma patayorayīṇām ||
Translation: Grant us our hearts' desire when we invoke thee: may we have store of riches in possession.

Sanskit Text: वसुं न चित्रमहसं गर्णीषे वामं शेवमतिथिमद्विषेण्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasuṃ na citramahasaṃ ghṛṇīṣe vāmaṃ śevamatithimadviṣeṇyam |
Translation: 1. I PRAISE the God of wondrous might like Indra, the lovely pleasant Guest whom all must welcome.

Sanskit Text: स रासते शुरुधो विश्वधायसो.अग्निर्होताग्र्हपतिः सुवीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa rāsate śurudho viśvadhāyaso.aghnirhotāghṛhapatiḥ suvīryam ||
Translation: May Agni, Priest and Master of the household, give hero strength and all-sustaining riches.

Sanskit Text: जुषाणो अग्ने परति हर्य मे वचो विश्वानि विद्वान वयुनानिसुक्रतो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: juṣāṇo aghne prati harya me vaco viśvāni vidvān vayunānisukrato |
Translation: 2 O Agni, graciously accept this song of mine, thou passing-wise who knowest every ordinance.

Sanskit Text: घर्तनिर्णिग बरह्मणे गातुमेरय तव देवाजनयन्ननु वरतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛtanirṇigh brahmaṇe ghātumeraya tava devāajanayannanu vratam ||
Translation: Enwrapped in holy oil further the course of prayer: the Gods bestow according to thy holy law.

Sanskit Text: सप्त धामानि परियन्नमर्त्यो दाशद दाशुषे सुक्र्तेमामहस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sapta dhāmāni pariyannamartyo dāśad dāśuṣe sukṛtemāmahasva |
Translation: 3 Immortal, wandering round the seven stations, give, a liberal Giver, to the pious worshipper,

Sanskit Text: सुवीरेण रयिणाग्ने सवाभुवा यस्त आनट्समिधा तं जुषस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suvīreṇa rayiṇāghne svābhuvā yasta ānaṭsamidhā taṃ juṣasva ||
Translation: Wealth, Agni, with brave sons and ready for his use: welcome the man who comes with fuel unto thee.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञस्य केतुं परथमं पुरोहितं हविष्मन्त ईळते सप्तवाजिनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñasya ketuṃ prathamaṃ purohitaṃ haviṣmanta īḷate saptavājinam |
Translation: 4 The seven who bring oblations worship thee, the Strong, the first, the Great Chief Priest, Ensign of sacrifice,

Sanskit Text: शर्ण्वन्तमग्निं घर्तप्र्ष्ठमुक्षणम्प्र्णन्तं देवं पर्णते सुवीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śṛṇvantamaghniṃ ghṛtapṛṣṭhamukṣaṇampṛṇantaṃ devaṃ pṛṇate suvīryam ||
Translation: The oil-anointed Bull, Agni who hears, who sends as God full hero strength to him who freely gives.

Sanskit Text: टवं दूतः परथमो वरेण्यः स हूयमानो अम्र्तायमत्स्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṭvaṃ dūtaḥ prathamo vareṇyaḥ sa hūyamāno amṛtāyamatsva |
Translation: 5 First messenger art thou, meet for election: drink thou thy fill invited to the Anirta,

Sanskit Text: तवां मर्जयन मरुतो दाशुषो गर्हे तवां सतोमेभिर्भ्र्गवो वि रुरुचुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ marjayan maruto dāśuṣo ghṛhe tvāṃ stomebhirbhṛghavo vi rurucuḥ ||
Translation: The Maruts in the votary's house adorned thee; with lauds the Bhṛgus gave thee light and glory.

Sanskit Text: इषं दुहन सुदुघां विश्वधायसं यज्ञप्रियेयजमानाय सुक्रतो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣaṃ duhan sudughāṃ viśvadhāyasaṃ yajñapriyeyajamānāya sukrato |
Translation: 6 Milking the teeming Cow for all-sustaining food. O Wise One, for the worship-loving worshipper,

Sanskit Text: अग्ने घर्तस्नुस्त्रिरतानि दीद्यद्वर्तिर्यज्ञं परियन सुक्रतूयसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne ghṛtasnustrirtāni dīdyadvartiryajñaṃ pariyan sukratūyase ||
Translation: Thou, Agni, dropping oil, thrice lighting works of Law, showest thy wisdom circling home and sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: तवामिदस्या उषसो वयुष्टिषु दूतं कर्ण्वाना अयजन्तमानुषाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmidasyā uṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu dūtaṃ kṛṇvānā ayajantamānuṣāḥ |
Translation: 7 They who at flushing of this dawn appointed thee their messenger, these men have paid thee reverence.

Sanskit Text: तवां देवा महयाय्याय वाव्र्धुराज्यमग्नेनिम्र्जन्तो अध्वरे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāṃ devā mahayāyyāya vāvṛdhurājyamaghnenimṛjanto adhvare ||
Translation: Gods strengthened thee for work that must be glorified, Agni, while they made butter pure for sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: नि तवा वसिष्ठा अह्वन्त वाजिनं गर्णन्तो अग्ने विदथेषुवेधसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni tvā vasiṣṭhā ahvanta vājinaṃ ghṛṇanto aghne vidatheṣuvedhasaḥ |
Translation: 8 Arrangers in our synods, Agni, while they sang Vasisistha s sons have called thee down, the Potent One.

Sanskit Text: रायस पोषं यजमानेषु धारय यूयं पातस्वस्तिभिः सदा नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyas poṣaṃ yajamāneṣu dhāraya yūyaṃ pātasvastibhiḥ sadā naḥ ||
Translation: Maintain the growth of wealth with men who sacrifice. Ye Gods, preserve us with your blessings evermore.

Sanskit Text: अयं वेनश्चोदयत पर्श्निगर्भा जयोतिर्जरायू रजसोविमाने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ venaścodayat pṛśnigharbhā jyotirjarāyū rajasovimāne |
Translation: 1. SEE, Vena, born in light, hath driven hither, on chariot of the air, the Calves of Pṛśni.

Sanskit Text: इममपां संगमे सूर्यस्य शिशुं न विप्रामतिभी रिहन्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imamapāṃ saṃghame sūryasya śiśuṃ na viprāmatibhī rihanti ||
Translation: Singers with hymns caress him as an infant there where the waters and the sunlight mingle.

Sanskit Text: समुद्रादूर्मिमुदियर्ति वेनो नभोजाः पर्ष्ठंहर्यतस्य दर्शि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samudrādūrmimudiyarti veno nabhojāḥ pṛṣṭhaṃharyatasya darśi |
Translation: 2 Vena draws up his wave from out the ocean. mist-born, the fair one's back is made apparent,

Sanskit Text: रतस्य सानावधि विष्टपि भराट्समानं योनिमभ्यनूषत वराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya sānāvadhi viṣṭapi bhrāṭsamānaṃ yonimabhyanūṣata vrāḥ ||
Translation: Brightly he shone aloft on Order's summit: the hosts sang glory to their common birthplace.

Sanskit Text: समानं पूर्वीरभि वावशानास्तिष्ठन वत्सस्यमातरः सनीळाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samānaṃ pūrvīrabhi vāvaśānāstiṣṭhan vatsasyamātaraḥ sanīḷāḥ |
Translation: 3 Full many, lowing to their joint-possession, dwelling together stood the Darling's Mothers.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य सानावधि चक्रमाणारिहन्ति मध्वो अम्र्तस्य वाणीः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya sānāvadhi cakramāṇārihanti madhvo amṛtasya vāṇīḥ ||
Translation: Ascending to the lofty height of Order, the bands of singers 'sip the sweets of Amṛta.

Sanskit Text: जानन्तो रूपमक्र्पन्त विप्रा मर्गस्य घोषं महिषस्य हिग्मन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: jānanto rūpamakṛpanta viprā mṛghasya ghoṣaṃ mahiṣasya highman |
Translation: 4 Knowing his form, the sages yearned to meet him: they have come nigh to hear the wild Bull's bellow.

Sanskit Text: रतेन यन्तो अधि सिन्धुमस्थुर्विदद गन्धर्वोम्र्तानि नाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtena yanto adhi sindhumasthurvidad ghandharvoamṛtāni nāma ||
Translation: Performing sacrifice they reached the river: for the Gandharva found the immortal waters.

Sanskit Text: अप्सरा जारमुपसिष्मियाणा योषा बिभर्ति परमे वयोमन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apsarā jāramupasiṣmiyāṇā yoṣā bibharti parame vyoman |
Translation: 5 The Apsaras, the Lady, sweetly smiling, supports her Lover in sublimest heaven.

Sanskit Text: चरत परियस्य योनिषु परियः सन सीदत पक्षे हिरण्ययेस वेनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: carat priyasya yoniṣu priyaḥ san sīdat pakṣe hiraṇyayesa venaḥ ||
Translation: In his Friend's dwelling as a Friend he wanders: he, Vena, rests him on his golden pinion.

Sanskit Text: नाके सुपर्णमुप यत पतन्तं हर्दा वेनन्तो अभ्यचक्षतत्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāke suparṇamupa yat patantaṃ hṛdā venanto abhyacakṣatatvā |
Translation: 6 They gaze on thee with longing in their spirit, as on a strong-winged bird that mounteth sky-ward;

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यपक्षं वरुणस्य दूतं यमस्य योनौशकुनं भुरण्युम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyapakṣaṃ varuṇasya dūtaṃ yamasya yonauśakunaṃ bhuraṇyum ||
Translation: On thee with wings of gold, Varuṇa's envoy, the Bird that hasteneth to the home of Yama.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्ध्वो गन्धर्वो अधि नाके अस्थात परत्यं चित्रा बिभ्रदस्यायुधानि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrdhvo ghandharvo adhi nāke asthāt pratyaṃ citrā bibhradasyāyudhāni |
Translation: 7 Erect, to heaven hath the Gandharva mounted, pointing at us his many-coloured weapons;

Sanskit Text: वसानो अत्कं सुरभिं दर्शे कं सवर्णनाम जनत परियाणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasāno atkaṃ surabhiṃ dṛśe kaṃ svarṇanāma janata priyāṇi ||
Translation: Clad in sweet raiment beautiful to look on, for he, as light, produceth forms that please us.

Sanskit Text: दरप्सः समुद्रमभि यज्जिगाति पश्यन गर्ध्रस्य चक्षसाविधर्मन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: drapsaḥ samudramabhi yajjighāti paśyan ghṛdhrasya cakṣasāvidharman |
Translation: 8 When as a spark he cometh near the ocean, still looking with a vulture's eye to heaven,

Sanskit Text: भानुः शुक्रेण शोचिषा चकानस्त्र्तीये चक्रेरजसि परियाणि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhānuḥ śukreṇa śociṣā cakānastṛtīye cakrerajasi priyāṇi ||
Translation: His lustre, joying in its own bright splendour, maketh dear glories in the lowest region.

Sanskit Text: इमं नो अग्न उप यज्ञमेहि पञ्चयामं तरिव्र्तंसप्ततन्तुम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ no aghna upa yajñamehi pañcayāmaṃ trivṛtaṃsaptatantum |
Translation: 1. COME to this sacrifice of ours, O Agni, threefold, with seven threads and five divisions.

Sanskit Text: असो हव्यवाळ उत नः पुरोगा जयोगेवदीर्घं तम आशयिष्ठाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aso havyavāḷ uta naḥ puroghā jyoghevadīrghaṃ tama āśayiṣṭhāḥ ||
Translation: Be our oblation-bearer and preceder: thou hast lain long enough in during darkness.

Sanskit Text: अदेवाद देवः परचता गुहा यन परपश्यमानो अम्र्तत्वमेमि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adevād devaḥ pracatā ghuhā yan prapaśyamāno amṛtatvamemi |
Translation: 2 I come a God foreseeing from the godless to immortality by secret pathways,

Sanskit Text: शिवं यत सन्तमशिवो जहामि सवात सख्यादरणींनाभिमेमि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śivaṃ yat santamaśivo jahāmi svāt sakhyādaraṇīṃnābhimemi ||
Translation: While I, ungracious one, desert the gracious, leave mine own friends and seek the kin of strangers.

Sanskit Text: पश्यन्नन्यस्या अतिथिं वयाया रतस्य धाम वि मिमेपुरूणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: paśyannanyasyā atithiṃ vayāyā ṛtasya dhāma vi mimepurūṇi |
Translation: 3 1, looking to the guest of other lineage, have founded many a rule of Law and Order.

Sanskit Text: शंसामि पित्रे असुराय शेवमयज्ञियाद्यज्ञियं भागमेमि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃsāmi pitre asurāya śevamayajñiyādyajñiyaṃ bhāghamemi ||
Translation: I bid farewell to the Great God, the Father, and, for neglect, obtain my share of worship.

Sanskit Text: बह्वीः समा अकरमन्तरस्मिन्निन्द्रं वर्णानः पितरंजहामि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bahvīḥ samā akaramantarasminnindraṃ vṛṇānaḥ pitaraṃjahāmi |
Translation: 4 I tarried many a year within this altar: I leave the Father, for my choice is Indra.

Sanskit Text: अग्निः सोमो वरुणस्ते चयवन्ते पर्यावर्द्राष्ट्रं तदवाम्यायन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniḥ somo varuṇaste cyavante paryāvardrāṣṭraṃ tadavāmyāyan ||
Translation: Away pass Agni, Varuṇa and Soma. Rule ever changes: this I come to favour.

Sanskit Text: निर्माया उ तये असुरा अभूवन तवं च मा वरुण कामयासे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nirmāyā u tye asurā abhūvan tvaṃ ca mā varuṇa kāmayāse |
Translation: 5 These Asuras have lost their powers of magic. But thou, O Varuṇa, if thou dost love me,

Sanskit Text: रतेन राजन्नन्र्तं विविञ्चन मम राष्ट्रस्याधिपत्यमेहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtena rājannanṛtaṃ viviñcan mama rāṣṭrasyādhipatyamehi ||
Translation: O King, discerning truth and right from falsehood, come and be Lord and Ruler of my kingdom.

Sanskit Text: इदं सवरिदमिदास वाममयं परकाश उर्वन्तरिक्षम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ svaridamidāsa vāmamayaṃ prakāśa urvantarikṣam |
Translation: 6 Here is the light of heaven, here allis lovely; here there is radiance, here is air's wide region.

Sanskit Text: हनाव वर्त्रं निरेहि सोम हविष टवा सन्तं हविषायजाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hanāva vṛtraṃ nirehi soma haviṣ ṭvā santaṃ haviṣāyajāma ||
Translation: Let us two slaughter Vṛtra. Forth, O Soma! Thou art oblation: we therewith will serve thee.

Sanskit Text: कविः कवित्वा दिवि रूपमासजदप्रभूती वरुणो निरपः सर्जत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaviḥ kavitvā divi rūpamāsajadaprabhūtī varuṇo nirapaḥ sṛjat |
Translation: 7 The Sage hath fixed his form by wisdom in the heavens: Varuṇa with no violence let the waters flow.

Sanskit Text: कषेमं कर्ण्वाना जनयो न सिन्धवश ता अस्यवर्णं शुचयो भरिभ्रति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣemaṃ kṛṇvānā janayo na sindhavaś tā asyavarṇaṃ śucayo bharibhrati ||
Translation: Like women-folk, the floods that bring prosperity have eau lit his hue and colour as they gleamed and shone.

Sanskit Text: ता अस्य जयेष्ठमिन्द्रियं सचन्ते ता ईमा कषेतिस्वधया मदन्तीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā asya jyeṣṭhamindriyaṃ sacante tā īmā kṣetisvadhayā madantīḥ |
Translation: 8 These wait upon his loftiest power and vigour: he dwells in these who triumph in their Godhead;

Sanskit Text: ता इं विशो न राजानं वर्णानाबीभत्सुवो अप वर्त्रादतिष्ठन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā iṃ viśo na rājānaṃ vṛṇānābībhatsuvo apa vṛtrādatiṣṭhan ||
Translation: And they, like people who elect their ruler, have in abhorrence turned away from Vṛtra.

Sanskit Text: बीभत्सूनां सयुजं हंसमाहुरपां दिव्यानांसख्ये चरन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bībhatsūnāṃ sayujaṃ haṃsamāhurapāṃ divyānāṃsakhye carantam |
Translation: 9 They call him Swan, the abhorrent floods' Companion, moving in friendship with celestial Waters.

Sanskit Text: अनुष्टुभमनु चर्चूर्यमाणमिन्द्रं निचिक्युः कवयो मनीषा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anuṣṭubhamanu carcūryamāṇamindraṃ nicikyuḥ kavayo manīṣā ||
Translation: The poets in their thought have looked on Indra swiftly approaching when Anustup calls him.

Sanskit Text: अहं रुद्रेभिर्वसुभिश्चराम्यहमादित्यैरुतविश्वदेवैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ rudrebhirvasubhiścarāmyahamādityairutaviśvadevaiḥ |
Translation: 1. I TRAVEL with the Rudras and the Vasus, with the Ādityas and All-Gods I wander.

Sanskit Text: अहं मित्रावरुणोभा बिभर्म्यहमिन्द्राग्नीहमश्विनोभा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ mitrāvaruṇobhā bibharmyahamindrāghnīahamaśvinobhā ||
Translation: I hold aloft both Varuṇa and Mitra, Indra and Agni, and the Pair of Aśvins.

Sanskit Text: अहं सोममाहनसं बिभर्म्यहं तवष्टारमुतपूषणं भगम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ somamāhanasaṃ bibharmyahaṃ tvaṣṭāramutapūṣaṇaṃ bhagham |
Translation: 2 I cherish and sustain high-swelling Soma, and Tvaṣṭar I support, Pūṣan, and Bhaga.

Sanskit Text: अहं दधामि दरविणं हविष्मतेसुप्राव्ये यजमानाय सुन्वते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ dadhāmi draviṇaṃ haviṣmatesuprāvye yajamānāya sunvate ||
Translation: I load with wealth the zealous sdcrificer who pours the juice and offers his oblation

Sanskit Text: अहं राष्ट्री संगमनी वसूनां चिकितुषी परथमायज्ञियानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ rāṣṭrī saṃghamanī vasūnāṃ cikituṣī prathamāyajñiyānām |
Translation: 3 I am the Queen, the gatherer-up of treasures, most thoughtful, first of those who merit worship.

Sanskit Text: तां मा देवा वयदधुः पुरुत्राभूरिस्थात्रां भूर्यावेशयन्तीम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāṃ mā devā vyadadhuḥ purutrābhūristhātrāṃ bhūryāveśayantīm ||
Translation: Thus Gods have stablished me in many places with many homes to enter and abide in.

Sanskit Text: मया सो अन्नमत्ति यो विपश्यति यः पराणिति य ईंश्र्णोत्युक्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mayā so annamatti yo vipaśyati yaḥ prāṇiti ya īṃśṛṇotyuktam |
Translation: 4 Through me alone all eat the food that feeds them,—each man who sees, brewhes, hears the word outspoken

Sanskit Text: अमन्तवो मां त उप कषियन्ति शरुधिश्रुत शरद्धिवं ते वदामि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: amantavo māṃ ta upa kṣiyanti śrudhiśruta śraddhivaṃ te vadāmi ||
Translation: They know it not, but yet they dwell beside me. Hear, one and all, the truth as I declare it.

Sanskit Text: अहमेव सवयमिदं वदामि जुष्टं देवेभिरुतमानुषेभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahameva svayamidaṃ vadāmi juṣṭaṃ devebhirutamānuṣebhiḥ |
Translation: 5 1, verily, myself announce and utter the word that Gods and men alike shall welcome.

Sanskit Text: यं कामये तं-तमुग्रं कर्णोमि तम्ब्रह्माणं तं रषिं तं सुमेधाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ kāmaye taṃ-tamughraṃ kṛṇomi tambrahmāṇaṃ taṃ ṛṣiṃ taṃ sumedhām ||
Translation: I make the man I love exceeding mighty, make him a sage, a Ṛṣi, and a Brahman.

Sanskit Text: अहं रुद्राय धनुरा तनोमि बरह्मद्विषे शरवे हन्तवाु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ rudrāya dhanurā tanomi brahmadviṣe śarave hantavāu |
Translation: 6 I bend the bow for Rudra that his arrow may strike and slay the hater of devotion.

Sanskit Text: अहं जनाय समदं कर्णोम्यहं दयावाप्र्थिवी आविवेश ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ janāya samadaṃ kṛṇomyahaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī āviveśa ||
Translation: I rouse and order battle for the people, and I have penetrated Earth and Heaven.

Sanskit Text: अहं सुवे पितरमस्य मूर्धन मम योनिरप्स्वन्तः समुद्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ suve pitaramasya mūrdhan mama yonirapsvantaḥ samudre |
Translation: 7 On the world's summit I bring forth the Father: my home is in the waters, in the ocean.

Sanskit Text: ततो वि तिष्ठे भुवनानु विश्वोतामूं दयांवर्ष्मणोप सप्र्शामि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tato vi tiṣṭhe bhuvanānu viśvotāmūṃ dyāṃvarṣmaṇopa spṛśāmi ||
Translation: Thence I extend o’er all existing creatures, and touch even yonder heaven with my forehead.

Sanskit Text: अहमेव वात इव पर वाम्यारभमाणा भुवनानि विश्वा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahameva vāta iva pra vāmyārabhamāṇā bhuvanāni viśvā |
Translation: 8 I breathe a strong breath like the wind and tempest, the while I hold together all existence.

Sanskit Text: परो दिवा पर एना पर्थिव्यैतावती महिना सं बभूव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: paro divā para enā pṛthivyaitāvatī mahinā saṃ babhūva ||
Translation: Beyond this wide earth and beyond the heavens I have become so mighty in my grandeur.

Sanskit Text: न तमंहो न दुरितं देवासो अष्ट मर्त्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na tamaṃho na duritaṃ devāso aṣṭa martyam |
Translation: 1. No peril, no severe distress, ye Gods, affects the mortal man,

Sanskit Text: सजोषसोयमर्यमा मित्रो नयन्ति वरुणो अति दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sajoṣasoyamaryamā mitro nayanti varuṇo ati dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: Whom Aryaman and Mitra lead, and Varima, of one accord, beyond his foes.

Sanskit Text: तद धि वयं वर्णीमहे वरुण मित्रार्यमन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tad dhi vayaṃ vṛṇīmahe varuṇa mitrāryaman |
Translation: 2 This very thing do we desire, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman,

Sanskit Text: येना निरंहसो यूयं पाथ नेथा च मर्त्यमति दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenā niraṃhaso yūyaṃ pātha nethā ca martyamati dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: Whereby ye guhrd the mortal man from sore distress, and lead him safe beyond his foes.

Sanskit Text: ते नूनं नो.अयमूतये वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te nūnaṃ no.ayamūtaye varuṇo mitro aryamā |
Translation: 3 These are, each one, our present helps, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman.

Sanskit Text: नयिष्था उनो नेषणि पर्षिष्ठा उ नः पर्षण्यति दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: nayiṣthā uno neṣaṇi parṣiṣṭhā u naḥ parṣaṇyati dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: Best leaders, best deliverers to lead us on and bear as safe beyond our foes.

Sanskit Text: यूयं विश्वं परि पाथ वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yūyaṃ viśvaṃ pari pātha varuṇo mitro aryamā |
Translation: 4 Ye compass round and guard each man, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman:

Sanskit Text: युष्माकंशर्मणि परिये सयाम सुप्रणीतयो.अति दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuṣmākaṃśarmaṇi priye syāma supraṇītayo.ati dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: In your dear keeping may we be, ye who are excellent as guides beyond our foes.

Sanskit Text: आदित्यासो अति सरिधो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityāso ati sridho varuṇo mitro aryamā |
Translation: 5 Ādityas are beyond all foes,—Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman:

Sanskit Text: उग्रं मरुद्भीरुद्रं हुवेमेन्द्रमग्निं सवस्तये.अति दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ughraṃ marudbhīrudraṃ huvemendramaghniṃ svastaye.ati dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: Strong Rudra with the Marut host, Indra, Agni let us call for weal beyond our foes.

Sanskit Text: नेतार ऊ षु णस्तिरो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: netāra ū ṣu ṇastiro varuṇo mitro aryamā |
Translation: 6 These lead us safely over all, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman,

Sanskit Text: अति विश्वानिदुरिता राजानश्चर्षणीनामति दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ati viśvāniduritā rājānaścarṣaṇīnāmati dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: These who are Kings of living men, over all troubles far away beyond our foes.

Sanskit Text: शुनमस्मभ्यमूतये वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śunamasmabhyamūtaye varuṇo mitro aryamā |
Translation: 7 May they give bliss to aid us well, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman:

Sanskit Text: शर्म यछन्तुसप्रथ आदित्यासो यदीमहे अति दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śarma yachantusapratha ādityāso yadīmahe ati dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: May the Ādityas, when we pray, grant us wide shelter and defence beyond our foes.

Sanskit Text: यथा ह तयद वसवो गौर्यं चित पदि षिताममुञ्चतायजत्राः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā ha tyad vasavo ghauryaṃ cit padi ṣitāmamuñcatāyajatrāḥ |
Translation: 8 As in this place, O Holy Ones, ye Vasus freed even the Gaud when her feet were fettered.

Sanskit Text: एवो षवस्मन मुञ्चता वयंहः पर तार्यग्नेप्रतरं न आयुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evo ṣvasman muñcatā vyaṃhaḥ pra tāryaghneprataraṃ na āyuḥ ||
Translation: So free us now from trouble and affliction: and let our life be lengthened still, O Api.

Sanskit Text: रात्री वयख्यदायती पुरुत्रा देव्यक्षभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rātrī vyakhyadāyatī purutrā devyakṣabhiḥ |
Translation: 1. WITH all her eyes the Goddess Night looks forth approaching many a spot:

Sanskit Text: विश्वाधि शरियो.अधित ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāadhi śriyo.adhita ||
Translation: She hath put all her glories on.

Sanskit Text: ओर्वप्रा अमर्त्या निवतो देव्युद्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: orvaprā amartyā nivato devyudvataḥ |
Translation: 2 Immortal. she hath filled the waste, the Goddess hath filled height and depth:

Sanskit Text: जयोतिषा बाधतेतमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jyotiṣā bādhatetamaḥ ||
Translation: She conquers darkness with her light.

Sanskit Text: निरु सवसारमस्क्र्तोषसं देव्यायती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: niru svasāramaskṛtoṣasaṃ devyāyatī |
Translation: 3 The Goddess as she comes hath set the Dawn her Sister in her place:

Sanskit Text: अपेदु हासतेतमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apedu hāsatetamaḥ ||
Translation: And then the darkness vanishes.

Sanskit Text: सा नो अद्य यस्या वयं नि ते यामन्न्नविक्ष्महि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sā no adya yasyā vayaṃ ni te yāmannnavikṣmahi |
Translation: 4 So favour us this night, O thou whose pathways we have visited

Sanskit Text: वर्क्षेन वसतिं वयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛkṣena vasatiṃ vayaḥ ||
Translation: As birds their nest upon the tree.

Sanskit Text: नि गरामासो अविक्षत नि पद्वन्तो नि पक्षिणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ni ghrāmāso avikṣata ni padvanto ni pakṣiṇaḥ |
Translation: 5 The villagers have sought their homes, and all that walks and all that flies,

Sanskit Text: निश्येनासश्चिदर्थिनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niśyenāsaścidarthinaḥ ||
Translation: Even the falcons fain for prey.

Sanskit Text: यावया वर्क्यं वर्कं यवय सतेनमूर्म्ये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāvayā vṛkyaṃ vṛkaṃ yavaya stenamūrmye |
Translation: 6 Keep off the she-wolf and the wolf, O Urmya, keep the thief away;

Sanskit Text: अथा नःसुतरा भव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā naḥsutarā bhava ||
Translation: Easy be thou for us to pass.

Sanskit Text: उप मा पेपिशत तमः कर्ष्णं वयक्तमस्थित |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa mā pepiśat tamaḥ kṛṣṇaṃ vyaktamasthita |
Translation: 7 Clearly hath she come nigh to me who decks the dark with richest hues:

Sanskit Text: उष रणेवयातय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣa ṛṇevayātaya ||
Translation: O Morning, cancel it like debts.

Sanskit Text: उप ते गा इवाकरं वर्णीष्व दुहितर्दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa te ghā ivākaraṃ vṛṇīṣva duhitardivaḥ |
Translation: 8 These have I brought to thee like kine. O Night, thou Child of Heaven, accept

Sanskit Text: रात्रि सतोमंन जिग्युषे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rātri stomaṃna jighyuṣe ||
Translation: This laud as for a conqueror.

Sanskit Text: ममाग्ने वर्चो विहवेष्वस्तु वयं तवेन्धानास्तन्वम्पुषेम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mamāghne varco vihaveṣvastu vayaṃ tvendhānāstanvampuṣema |
Translation: 1. LET me win glory, Agni, in our battles: enkindling thee, may we support our bodies.

Sanskit Text: मह्यं नमन्तां परदिशश्चतस्रस्त्वयाध्यक्षेणप्र्तना जयेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahyaṃ namantāṃ pradiśaścatasrastvayādhyakṣeṇapṛtanā jayema ||
Translation: May the four regions bend and bow before me: with thee for guardian may we win in combat.

Sanskit Text: मम देवा विहवे सन्तु सर्व इन्द्रवन्तो मरुतो विष्णुरग्निः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mama devā vihave santu sarva indravanto maruto viṣṇuraghniḥ |
Translation: 2 May all the Gods be on my side in battle, the Maruts led by Indra, Viṣṇu, Agni.

Sanskit Text: ममान्तरिक्षमुरुलोकमस्तु मह्यं वातः पवतांकामे अस्मिन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mamāntarikṣamurulokamastu mahyaṃ vātaḥ pavatāṃkāme asmin ||
Translation: Mine be the middle air's extended region, and may the wind blow favouring these my wishes.

Sanskit Text: मयि देवा दरविणमा यजन्तां मय्याशीरस्तु मयिदेवहूतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mayi devā draviṇamā yajantāṃ mayyāśīrastu mayidevahūtiḥ |
Translation: 3 May the Gods grant me riches; may the blessing and invocation of the Gods assist me.

Sanskit Text: दैव्या होतारो वनुषन्त पूर्वे.अरिष्टाःस्याम तन्वा सुवीराः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: daivyā hotāro vanuṣanta pūrve.ariṣṭāḥsyāma tanvā suvīrāḥ ||
Translation: Foremost in fight be the divine Invokers: may we, unwounded, have brave heroes round us.

Sanskit Text: मह्यं यजन्तु मम यानि हव्याकूतिः सत्या मनसो मे अस्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahyaṃ yajantu mama yāni havyākūtiḥ satyā manaso me astu |
Translation: 4 For me let them present all mine oblations, and let my mind's intention be accomplished.

Sanskit Text: एनो मा नि गां कतमच्चनाहं विश्वे देवासो अधिवोचता नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: eno mā ni ghāṃ katamaccanāhaṃ viśve devāso adhivocatā naḥ ||
Translation: May I he guiltless of the least transgression: and, all ye Gods, do ye combine to bless us.

Sanskit Text: देवीः षळ उर्वीरुरु नः कर्णोत विश्वे देवास इहवीरयध्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devīḥ ṣaḷ urvīruru naḥ kṛṇota viśve devāsa ihavīrayadhvam |
Translation: 5 Ye six divine Expanses, grant us freedom: here, all ye Gods, acquit yourselves like heroes.

Sanskit Text: मा हास्महि परजया मा तनूभिर्मा रधामद्विषते सोम राजन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mā hāsmahi prajayā mā tanūbhirmā radhāmadviṣate soma rājan ||
Translation: Let us not lose our children or our bodies: let us not benefit the foe, King Soma!

Sanskit Text: अग्ने मन्युं परतिनुदन परेषामदब्धो गोपाः परि पाहि नस्त्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne manyuṃ pratinudan pareṣāmadabdho ghopāḥ pari pāhi nastvam |
Translation: 6 Baffling the wrath of our opponents, Agni, guard us as our infallible Protector.

Sanskit Text: परत्यञ्चो यन्तु निगुतः पुनस्ते.अमैषां चित्तम्प्रबुधां वि नेशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratyañco yantu nighutaḥ punaste.amaiṣāṃ cittamprabudhāṃ vi neśat ||
Translation: Let these thy foes turn back and seek their houses, and let their thought who watch at home be ruined.

Sanskit Text: धाता धातॄणां भुवनस्य यस पतिर्देवं तरातारमभिमातिषाहम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhātā dhātṝṇāṃ bhuvanasya yas patirdevaṃ trātāramabhimātiṣāham |
Translation: 7 Lord of the world, Creator of creators the saviour God who overcomes the foeman.

Sanskit Text: इमं यज्ञमश्विनोभा बर्हस्पतिर्देवाः पान्तु यजमानं नयर्थात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ yajñamaśvinobhā bṛhaspatirdevāḥ pāntu yajamānaṃ nyarthāt ||
Translation: May Gods, Bṛhaspati, both Aśvins shelter from ill this sacrifice and sacrificer.

Sanskit Text: उरुव्यचा नो महिषः शर्म यंसदस्मिन हवे पुरुहूतःपुरुक्षुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uruvyacā no mahiṣaḥ śarma yaṃsadasmin have puruhūtaḥpurukṣuḥ |
Translation: 8 Foodful, and much-invoked, at this our calling may the great Bull vouchsafe us wide protection.

Sanskit Text: स नः परजायै हर्यश्व मर्ळयेन्द्र मा नोरीरिषो मा परा दाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ prajāyai haryaśva mṛḷayendra mā norīriṣo mā parā dāḥ ||
Translation: Lord of Bay Coursers, Indra, blew our children: harm us not, give us not as prey to others.

Sanskit Text: ये नः सपत्ना अप ते भवन्त्विन्द्राग्निभ्यामव बाधामहेतान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye naḥ sapatnā apa te bhavantvindrāghnibhyāmava bādhāmahetān |
Translation: 9 Let those who are our foemen stay. afar from us: with Indra and with Agni we will drive them off.

Sanskit Text: वसवो रुद्रा आदित्या उपरिस्प्र्शं मोग्रं चेत्तारमधिराजमक्रन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasavo rudrā ādityā uparispṛśaṃ moghraṃ cettāramadhirājamakran ||
Translation: Vasus, Ādityas, Rudras have exalted me, made me far-reaching, mighty, thinker, sovran lord.

Sanskit Text: नासदासीन नो सदासीत तदानीं नासीद रजो नो वयोमापरो यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nāsadāsīn no sadāsīt tadānīṃ nāsīd rajo no vyomāparo yat |
Translation: 1. THEN was not non-existent nor existent: there was no realm of air, no sky beyond it.

Sanskit Text: किमावरीवः कुह कस्य शर्मन्नम्भः किमासीद गहनं गभीरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kimāvarīvaḥ kuha kasya śarmannambhaḥ kimāsīd ghahanaṃ ghabhīram ||
Translation: What covered in, and where? and what gave shelter? Was water there, unfathomed depth of water?

Sanskit Text: न मर्त्युरासीदम्र्तं न तर्हि न रात्र्या अह्न आसीत्प्रकेतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na mṛtyurāsīdamṛtaṃ na tarhi na rātryā ahna āsītpraketaḥ |
Translation: 2 Death was not then, nor was there aught immortal: no sign was there, the day's and night's divider.

Sanskit Text: आनीदवातं सवधया तदेकं तस्माद्धान्यन न परः किं चनास ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ānīdavātaṃ svadhayā tadekaṃ tasmāddhānyan na paraḥ kiṃ canāsa ||
Translation: That One Thing, breathless, breathed by its own nature: apart from it was nothing whatsoever.

Sanskit Text: तम आसीत तमसा गूळमग्रे.अप्रकेतं सलिलं सर्वमािदम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tama āsīt tamasā ghūḷamaghre.apraketaṃ salilaṃ sarvamāidam |
Translation: 3 Darkness there was: at first concealed in darkness this All was indiscriminated chaos.

Sanskit Text: तुछ्येनाभ्वपिहितं यदासीत तपसस्तन्महिनाजायतैकम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tuchyenābhvapihitaṃ yadāsīt tapasastanmahinājāyataikam ||
Translation: All that existed then was void and form less: by the great power of Warmth was born that Unit.

Sanskit Text: कामस्तदग्रे समवर्तताधि मनसो रेतः परथमं यदासीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kāmastadaghre samavartatādhi manaso retaḥ prathamaṃ yadāsīt |
Translation: 4 Thereafter rose Desire in the beginning, Desire, the primal seed and germ of Spirit.

Sanskit Text: सतो बन्धुमसति निरविन्दन हर्दि परतीष्याकवयो मनीषा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sato bandhumasati niravindan hṛdi pratīṣyākavayo manīṣā ||
Translation: Sages who searched with their heart's thought discovered the existent's kinship in the non-existent.

Sanskit Text: तिरश्चीनो विततो रश्मिरेषामधः सविदासी.अ.अ.अत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tiraścīno vitato raśmireṣāmadhaḥ svidāsī.a.a.at |
Translation: 5 Transversely was their severing line extended: what was above it then, and what below it?

Sanskit Text: रेतोधाासन महिमान आसन सवधा अवस्तात परयतिः परस्तात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: retodhāāsan mahimāna āsan svadhā avastāt prayatiḥ parastāt ||
Translation: There were begetters, there were mighty forces, free action here and energy up yonder

Sanskit Text: को अद्धा वेद क इह पर वोचत कुत आजाता कुत इयंविस्र्ष्टिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ko addhā veda ka iha pra vocat kuta ājātā kuta iyaṃvisṛṣṭiḥ |
Translation: 6 Who verily knows and who can here declare it, whence it was born and whence comes this creation?

Sanskit Text: अर्वाग देवा अस्य विसर्जनेनाथा को वेद यताबभूव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arvāgh devā asya visarjanenāthā ko veda yataābabhūva ||
Translation: The Gods are later than this world's production. Who knows then whence it first came into being?

Sanskit Text: इयं विस्र्ष्टिर्यत आबभूव यदि वा दधे यदि वा न |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyaṃ visṛṣṭiryata ābabhūva yadi vā dadhe yadi vā na |
Translation: 7 He, the first origin of this creation, whether he formed it all or did not form it,

Sanskit Text: यो अस्याध्यक्षः परमे वयोमन सो अङग वेद यदि वा नवेद ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo asyādhyakṣaḥ parame vyoman so aṅgha veda yadi vā naveda ||
Translation: Whose eye controls this world in highest heaven, he verily knows it, or perhaps he knows not.

Sanskit Text: यो यज्ञो विश्वतस्तन्तुभिस्तत एकशतं देवकर्मेभिरायतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo yajño viśvatastantubhistata ekaśataṃ devakarmebhirāyataḥ |
Translation: 1. THE sacrifice drawn out with threads on every side, stretched by a hundred sacred ministers and one,—

Sanskit Text: इमे वयन्ति पितरो य आययुः पर वयाप वयेत्यासते तते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime vayanti pitaro ya āyayuḥ pra vayāpa vayetyāsate tate ||
Translation: This do these Fathers weave who hitherward are come: they sit beside the warp and cry, Weave forth, weave back.

Sanskit Text: पुमानेनं तनुत उत कर्णत्ति पुमान वि तत्ने अधि नाकेस्मिन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pumānenaṃ tanuta ut kṛṇatti pumān vi tatne adhi nākeasmin |
Translation: 2 The Man extends it and the Man unbinds it: even to this vault of heaven hath he outspun, it.

Sanskit Text: इमे मयूखा उप सेदुरू सदः सामानि चक्रुस्तसराण्योतवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ime mayūkhā upa sedurū sadaḥ sāmāni cakrustasarāṇyotave ||
Translation: These pegs are fastened to the seat of worship: they made the Sāma-hymns their weaving shuttles.

Sanskit Text: कासीत परमा परतिमा किं निदानमाज्यं किमासीत्परिधिः क आसीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kāsīt pramā pratimā kiṃ nidānamājyaṃ kimāsītparidhiḥ ka āsīt |
Translation: 3 What were the rule, the order and the model? What were the wooden fender and the butter?

Sanskit Text: छन्दः किमासीत परौगं किमुक्थंयद देवा देवमयजन्त विश्वे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: chandaḥ kimāsīt praughaṃ kimukthaṃyad devā devamayajanta viśve ||
Translation: What were the hymn, the chant, the recitation, when to the God all Deities paid worship?

Sanskit Text: अग्नेर्गायत्र्यभवत सयुग्वोष्णिहया सविता सं बभूव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnerghāyatryabhavat sayughvoṣṇihayā savitā saṃ babhūva |
Translation: 4 Closely was Gāyatrī conjoined with Agni, and closely Savitar combined with Usnih.

Sanskit Text: अनुष्टुभा सोम उक्थैर्महस्वान बर्हस्पतेर्ब्र्हती वाचमावत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anuṣṭubhā soma ukthairmahasvān bṛhaspaterbṛhatī vācamāvat ||
Translation: Brilliant with Ukthas, Soma joined Anustup: Bṛhaspati's voice by Brhati was aided.

Sanskit Text: विराण मित्रावरुणयोरभिश्रीरिन्द्रस्य तरिष्टुब इहभागो अह्नः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: virāṇ mitrāvaruṇayorabhiśrīrindrasya triṣṭub ihabhāgho ahnaḥ |
Translation: 5 Virāj adhered to Varuṇa and Mitra: here Triṣṭup day by day was Indra's portion.

Sanskit Text: विश्वान देवाञ जगत्या विवेश तेनचाक्ळिप्र रषयो मनुष्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvān devāñ jaghatyā viveśa tenacākḷipra ṛṣayo manuṣyāḥ ||
Translation: Jagatī entered all the Gods together: so by this knowledge men were raised to Ṛṣis.

Sanskit Text: चाक्ळिप्रे तेन रषयो मनुष्या यज्ञे जाते पितरो नःपुराणे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: cākḷipre tena ṛṣayo manuṣyā yajñe jāte pitaro naḥpurāṇe |
Translation: 6 So by this knowledge men were raised to Ṛṣis, when ancient sacrifice sprang up, our Fathers.

Sanskit Text: पश्यन मन्ये मनसा चक्षसा तान य इमंयज्ञमयजन्त पूर्वे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: paśyan manye manasā cakṣasā tān ya imaṃyajñamayajanta pūrve ||
Translation: With the mind's eye I think that I behold them who first performed this sacrificial worship.

Sanskit Text: सहस्तोमाः सहछन्दस आव्र्तः सहप्रमा रषयः सप्तदैव्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahastomāḥ sahachandasa āvṛtaḥ sahapramā ṛṣayaḥ saptadaivyāḥ |
Translation: 7 They who were versed in ritual and metre, in hymns and rules, were the Seven Godlike Ṛṣis.

Sanskit Text: पूर्वेषां पन्थामनुद्र्श्य धीरा अन्वालेभिरेरथ्यो न रश्मीन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrveṣāṃ panthāmanudṛśya dhīrā anvālebhirerathyo na raśmīn ||
Translation: Viewing the path of those of old, the sages have taken up the reins like chariot-drivers.

Sanskit Text: अप पराच इन्द्र विश्वानमित्रानपापाचो अभिभूते नुदस्व |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apa prāca indra viśvānamitrānapāpāco abhibhūte nudasva |
Translation: 1. DRIVE all our enemies away, O Indra, the western, mighty Conqueror, and the eastern.

Sanskit Text: अपोदीचो अप शूराधराच उरौ यथा तव शर्मन्मदेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apodīco apa śūrādharāca urau yathā tava śarmanmadema ||
Translation: Hero, drive off our northern foes and southern, that we in thy wide shelter may be joyful.

Sanskit Text: कुविदङग यवमन्तो यवं चिद यथा दान्त्यनुपूर्वंवियूय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kuvidaṅgha yavamanto yavaṃ cid yathā dāntyanupūrvaṃviyūya |
Translation: 2 What then? As men whose fields are full of barley reap the ripe corn removing it in order,

Sanskit Text: इहेहैषां कर्णुहि भोजनानि ये बर्हिषोनमोव्र्क्तिं न जग्मुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ihehaiṣāṃ kṛṇuhi bhojanāni ye barhiṣonamovṛktiṃ na jaghmuḥ ||
Translation: So bring the food of those men, bring it hither, who went not to prepare the grass for worship.

Sanskit Text: नहि सथूर्य रतुथा यातमस्ति नोत शरवो विविदेसंगमेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahi sthūry ṛtuthā yātamasti nota śravo vividesaṃghameṣu |
Translation: 3 Men come not with one horse at sacred seasons; thus they obtain no honour in assemblies.

Sanskit Text: गव्यन्त इन्द्रं सख्याय विप्रा अश्वायन्तोव्र्षणं वाजयन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghavyanta indraṃ sakhyāya viprā aśvāyantovṛṣaṇaṃ vājayantaḥ ||
Translation: Sages desiring herds of kine and horses strengthen the mighty Indra for his friendship.

Sanskit Text: युवं सुराममश्विना नमुचावासुरे सचा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ surāmamaśvinā namucāvāsure sacā |
Translation: 4 Ye, Aśvins, Lords of Splendour, drank full draughts of grateful Soma juice,

Sanskit Text: विपिपानाशुभस पती इन्द्रं कर्मस्वावतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vipipānāśubhas patī indraṃ karmasvāvatam ||
Translation: And aided Indra in his work with Namuci of Asura birth.

Sanskit Text: पुत्रमिव पितरावश्विनोभेन्द्रावथुः काव्यैर्दंसनाभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: putramiva pitarāvaśvinobhendrāvathuḥ kāvyairdaṃsanābhiḥ |
Translation: 5 As parents aid a son, both Aśvins, Indra, aided thee with their wondrous Powers and wisdom.

Sanskit Text: यत सुरामं वयपिबः शचीभिः सरस्वतीत्वा मघवन्नभिष्णक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yat surāmaṃ vyapibaḥ śacībhiḥ sarasvatītvā maghavannabhiṣṇak ||
Translation: When thou, with might. hadst drunk the draught that gladdens, Sarasvatī, O Maghavan, refreshed thee.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रः सुत्रामा सववानवोभिः सुम्र्ळीको भवतुविश्ववेदाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraḥ sutrāmā svavānavobhiḥ sumṛḷīko bhavatuviśvavedāḥ |
Translation: 6 Indra is strong to save, rich in assistance may he, possessing all, be kind and gracious.

Sanskit Text: बाधतां दवेषो अभयं कर्णोतु सुवीर्यस्यपतयः सयाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bādhatāṃ dveṣo abhayaṃ kṛṇotu suvīryasyapatayaḥ syāma ||
Translation: May he disperse our foes and give us safety, and may we be the lords of hero vigou r.

Sanskit Text: तस्य वयं सुमतौ यज्ञियस्यापि भद्रे सौमनसे सयाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma |
Translation: 7 May we enjoy his favour, his the Holy may we enjoy his blessed loving kindness.

Sanskit Text: स सुत्रामा सववानिन्द्रो अस्मे आराच्चिद दवेषः सनुतर्युयोतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sutrāmā svavānindro asme ārāccid dveṣaḥ sanutaryuyotu ||
Translation: May this rich Indra, as our good Protector, drive off and keep afar all those who hate us.

Sanskit Text: ईजानमिद दयौर्गूर्तावसुरीजानं भूमिरभिप्रभूषणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ījānamid dyaurghūrtāvasurījānaṃ bhūmirabhiprabhūṣaṇi |
Translation: 1. MAY Dyaus the Lord of lauded wealth, and Earth stand by the man who offers sacrifice,

Sanskit Text: ईजानं देवावश्विनावभि सुम्नैरवर्धताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ījānaṃ devāvaśvināvabhi sumnairavardhatām ||
Translation: And may the Aśvins, both the Gods, strengthen the worshipper with bliss.

Sanskit Text: ता वां मित्रावरुणा धारयत्क्षिती सुषुम्नेषितत्वतायजामसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā dhārayatkṣitī suṣumneṣitatvatāyajāmasi |
Translation: 2 As such we honour you, Mitra and Varuṇa, with hasty zeal, most blest, you who sustain the folk.

Sanskit Text: युवोः कराणाय सख्यैरभि षयाम रक्षसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvoḥ krāṇāya sakhyairabhi ṣyāma rakṣasaḥ ||
Translation: So may we, through your friendship for the worshipper, subdue the fiends.

Sanskit Text: अधा चिन नु यद दिधिषामहे वामभि परियं रेक्णःपत्यमानाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhā cin nu yad didhiṣāmahe vāmabhi priyaṃ rekṇaḥpatyamānāḥ |
Translation: 3 And when we seek to win your love and friendship, weẉho have precious wealth in our possession,

Sanskit Text: दद्वान वा यत पुष्यति रेक्णः सं वारन्नकिरस्य मघानि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadvān vā yat puṣyati rekṇaḥ saṃ vārannakirasya maghāni ||
Translation: Or when the worshipper augments his riches let not his treasures be shut up

Sanskit Text: असावन्यो असुर सूयत दयौस्त्वं विश्वेषां वरुणासिराजा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asāvanyo asura sūyata dyaustvaṃ viśveṣāṃ varuṇāsirājā |
Translation: 4 That other, Asura! too was born of Heaven. thou art, O Varuṇa, the King of all men.

Sanskit Text: मूर्धा रथस्य चाकन नैतावतैनसान्तकध्रुक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mūrdhā rathasya cākan naitāvatainasāntakadhruk ||
Translation: The chariot's Lord was well content, forbearing to anger Death by sin so great.

Sanskit Text: अस्मिन सवेतच्छकपूत एनो हिते मित्रे निगतान हन्ति वीरान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmin svetacchakapūta eno hite mitre nighatān hanti vīrān |
Translation: This sin hath Sakaputa here committed. Heroes who fled to their dear friend he slayeth,

Sanskit Text: अवोर्वा यद धात तनूष्ववः परियासु यज्ञियास्वर्वा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avorvā yad dhāt tanūṣvavaḥ priyāsu yajñiyāsvarvā ||
Translation: When the Steed bringeth down your grace and favour in bodies dear and worshipful.

Sanskit Text: युवोर्हि मातादितिर्विचेतसा दयौर्न भूमिः पयसापुपूतनि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvorhi mātāditirvicetasā dyaurna bhūmiḥ payasāpupūtani |
Translation: 6 Your Mother Aditi, ye wise, was purified with water even as earth is purified from heaven.

Sanskit Text: अव परिया दिदिष्टन सूरो निनिक्त रश्मिभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava priyā didiṣṭana sūro ninikta raśmibhiḥ ||
