Translation: Show love and kindness here below: wash her in rays of heavenly light.

Sanskit Text: युवं हयप्नराजावसीदतं तिष्ठद रथं नधूर्षदं वनर्षदम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ hyapnarājāvasīdataṃ tiṣṭhad rathaṃ nadhūrṣadaṃ vanarṣadam |
Translation: 7 Ye Twain have seated you as Lords of Wealth, as one who mounts a car to him who sits upon the pole, upon the wood.

Sanskit Text: ता नः कणूकयन्तीर्न्र्मेधस्तत्रे अंहसः सुमेधस्तत्रे अंहसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā naḥ kaṇūkayantīrnṛmedhastatre aṃhasaḥ sumedhastatre aṃhasaḥ ||
Translation: These our disheartened tribes Nrmedhas saved from woe, Sumedhas saved from Woe.

Sanskit Text: परो षवस्मै पुरोरथमिन्द्राय शूषमर्चत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pro ṣvasmai purorathamindrāya śūṣamarcata |
Translation: 1. SING strength to Indra that shall set his chariot in the foremost place.

Sanskit Text: अभीके चिदुलोकक्र्त संगे समत्सु वर्त्रहास्माकं बोधि चोदितानभन्तामन्यकेषां जयाका अधि धन्वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhīke cidulokakṛt saṃghe samatsu vṛtrahāsmākaṃ bodhi coditānabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākā adhi dhanvasu ||
Translation: Giver of room in closest fight, slayer of foes in shock of war, be thou our great encourager. Let the weak bowstrings break upon the bows of feeble enemies.

Sanskit Text: तवं सिन्धून्रवास्र्जो.अधराचो अहन्नहिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ sindhūnravāsṛjo.adharāco ahannahim |
Translation: 2 Thou didst destroy the Dragon: thou sentest the rivers down to earth.

Sanskit Text: अशत्रुरिन्द्रजज्ञिषे विश्वं पुष्यसि वार्यं तं तवा परि षवजामहेनभन्तामन्यकेषां जयाका अधि धन्वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśatrurindrajajñiṣe viśvaṃ puṣyasi vāryaṃ taṃ tvā pari ṣvajāmahenabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākā adhi dhanvasu ||
Translation: Foeless, O Indra, wast thou born. Thou tendest well each choicest thing. Therefore we draw us close to thee. Let the weak bowstrings break upon the bows of feeble enemies.

Sanskit Text: वि षु विश्वा अरातयो.अर्यो नशन्त नो धियः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi ṣu viśvā arātayo.aryo naśanta no dhiyaḥ |
Translation: 3 Destroyed be all malignities and all our enemy's designs.

Sanskit Text: अस्तासिशत्रवे वधं यो न इन्द्र जिघांसति या ते रातिर्ददिर्वसु नभन्तामन्यकेषां जयाका अधि धन्वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: astāsiśatrave vadhaṃ yo na indra jighāṃsati yā te rātirdadirvasu nabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākā adhi dhanvasu ||
Translation: Thy bolt thou castest, at the foe, O Indra, who would srnite us dead: thy liberal bounty gives us wealth.

Sanskit Text: यो न इन्द्राभितो जनो वर्कायुरादिदेशति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo na indrābhito jano vṛkāyurādideśati |
Translation: 4 The robber people round about, Indra, who watch and aim at us,—

Sanskit Text: अधस्पदं तमीं कर्धि विबाधो असि सासहिर्नभन्तामन्यकेषां जयाकाधि धन्वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhaspadaṃ tamīṃ kṛdhi vibādho asi sāsahirnabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākāadhi dhanvasu ||
Translation: Trample them down beneath thy foot; a conquering scatterer art thou.

Sanskit Text: यो न इन्द्राभिदासति सनाभिर्यश्च निष्ट्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo na indrābhidāsati sanābhiryaśca niṣṭyaḥ |
Translation: 5 Whoso assails us, Indra, be the man a stranger or akin,

Sanskit Text: अव तस्यबलं तिर महीव दयौरध तमना नभन्तामन्यकेषांज्याका अधि धन्वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava tasyabalaṃ tira mahīva dyauradha tmanā nabhantāmanyakeṣāṃjyākā adhi dhanvasu ||
Translation: Bring down, thyself, his strength although it be as vast as are the heavens.

Sanskit Text: वयमिन्द्र तवायवः सखित्वमा रभामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vayamindra tvāyavaḥ sakhitvamā rabhāmahe |
Translation: 6 Close to thy friendship do we cling, O Indra, and depend, or, thee.

Sanskit Text: रतस्य नःपथा नयाति विश्वानि दुरिता नभन्तामन्यकेषांज्याका अधि धन्वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtasya naḥpathā nayāti viśvāni duritā nabhantāmanyakeṣāṃjyākā adhi dhanvasu ||
Translation: Lead us beyond all pain and grief along the path of holy Law.

Sanskit Text: अस्मभ्यं सु तवमिन्द्र तां शिक्ष या दोहते परति वरंजरित्रे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asmabhyaṃ su tvamindra tāṃ śikṣa yā dohate prati varaṃjaritre |
Translation: 7 Do thou bestow upon us her, O Indra, who yields according to the singer's longing,

Sanskit Text: अछिद्रोध्नी पीपयद यथा नः सहस्रधारापयसा मही गौः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: achidrodhnī pīpayad yathā naḥ sahasradhārāpayasā mahī ghauḥ ||
Translation: That the great Cow may, with exhaustless udder, pouring a thousand streams, give milk to feed us.

Sanskit Text: उभे यदिन्द्र रोदसी आपप्राथोषा इव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhe yadindra rodasī āpaprāthoṣā iva |
Translation: 1. As, like the Morning, thou hast filled, O Indra, both the earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: महान्तं तवामहीनां सम्राजं चर्षणीनां देवी जनित्र्यजीजनद्भद्रा जनित्र्यजीजनत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahāntaṃ tvāmahīnāṃ samrājaṃ carṣaṇīnāṃ devī janitryajījanadbhadrā janitryajījanat ||
Translation: So as the Mighty One, great King of all the mighty world of men, the Goddess Mother brought thee forth, the Blessed Mother gave thee life.

Sanskit Text: अव सम दुर्हणायतो मर्तस्य तनुहि सथिरम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava sma durhaṇāyato martasya tanuhi sthiram |
Translation: 2 Relax that mortal's stubborn strength whose heart is bent on wickedness.

Sanskit Text: अधस्पदं तमीं कर्धि यो अस्मानादिदेशति देवी जनित्र्यजीजनद भद्राजनित्र्यजीजनत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: adhaspadaṃ tamīṃ kṛdhi yo asmānādideśati devī janitryajījanad bhadrājanitryajījanat ||
Translation: Trample him down beneath thy feet who watches for and aims at us. The Goddess Mother brought thee forth, the Blessed Mother gave thee life.

Sanskit Text: अव तया बर्हतीरिषो विश्वश्चन्द्रा अमित्रहन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava tyā bṛhatīriṣo viśvaścandrā amitrahan |
Translation: 3 Shake down, O Slayer of the foe, those great all splendid enemies.

Sanskit Text: शचीभिःशक्र धूनुहीन्द्र विश्वाभिरूतिभिर्देवी जनित्र्य ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śacībhiḥśakra dhūnuhīndra viśvābhirūtibhirdevī janitry ... ||
Translation: With all thy powers, O Śakra, all thine helps, O Indra, shake them down:

Sanskit Text: अव यत तवं शतक्रतविन्द्र विश्वानि धूनुषे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava yat tvaṃ śatakratavindra viśvāni dhūnuṣe |
Translation: 4 As thou, O Śatakratu, thou, O Indrv, shakest all things down

Sanskit Text: रयिंन सुन्वते सचा सहस्रिणीभिरूतिभिर्देवी जनित्र्य ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rayiṃna sunvate sacā sahasriṇībhirūtibhirdevī janitry ... ||
Translation: As wealth for him who sheds the juice, with thine assistance thousandfold.

Sanskit Text: अव सवेदा इवाभितो विष्वक पतन्तु दिद्यवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava svedā ivābhito viṣvak patantu didyavaḥ |
Translation: 5 Around, on every side like drops of sweat let lightning-flashes fall.

Sanskit Text: दूर्वाया इवतन्तवो वयस्मदेतु दुर्मतिर्देवी जनीत्र्य ... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dūrvāyā ivatantavo vyasmadetu durmatirdevī janītry ... ||
Translation: Let all malevolence pass away from us like threads of Darva grass.

Sanskit Text: दीर्घं हयङकुशं यथा शक्तिं बिभर्षि मन्तुमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dīrghaṃ hyaṅkuśaṃ yathā śaktiṃ bibharṣi mantumaḥ |
Translation: 6 Thou bearest in thine hand a lance like a long hook, great Counsellor!

Sanskit Text: पूर्वेण मघवन पदाजो वयां यथा यमो देवी जनित्र्य... ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pūrveṇa maghavan padājo vayāṃ yathā yamo devī janitry... ||
Translation: As with his foremost foot a goat, draw down the branch, O Maghavan.

Sanskit Text: नकिर्देवा मिनीमसि नकिरा योपयामसि मन्त्रश्रुत्यंचरामसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nakirdevā minīmasi nakirā yopayāmasi mantraśrutyaṃcarāmasi |
Translation: 7 Never, O Gods, do we offend, nor are we ever obstinate: we walk as holy texts command.

Sanskit Text: पक्षेभिरपिकक्षेभिरत्राभि सं रभामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pakṣebhirapikakṣebhiratrābhi saṃ rabhāmahe ||
Translation: Closely we clasp and cling to you, cling to your sides, beneath your arms.

Sanskit Text: यस्मिन वर्क्षे सुपलाशे देवैः सम्पिबते यमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasmin vṛkṣe supalāśe devaiḥ sampibate yamaḥ |
Translation: 1. IN the Tree clothed with goodly leaves where Yama drinketh with the Gods,

Sanskit Text: अत्रा नोविश्पतिः पिता पुराणाननु वेनति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atrā noviśpatiḥ pitā purāṇānanu venati ||
Translation: The Father, Master of the house, tendeth with love our ancient Sires.

Sanskit Text: पुराणाननुवेनन्तं चरन्तं पापयामुया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: purāṇānanuvenantaṃ carantaṃ pāpayāmuyā |
Translation: 2 I looked reluctantly on him who cherishes those men of old,

Sanskit Text: असूयन्नभ्यचाक्षं तस्मा अस्प्र्हयं पुनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: asūyannabhyacākṣaṃ tasmā aspṛhayaṃ punaḥ ||
Translation: On him who treads that evil path, and then I yearned for this again.

Sanskit Text: यं कुमार नवं रथमचक्रं मनसाक्र्णोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ kumāra navaṃ rathamacakraṃ manasākṛṇoḥ |
Translation: 3 Thou mountest, though thou dost not see, O Child, the new and wheel-less car

Sanskit Text: एकेषंविश्वतः पराञ्चमपश्यन्नधि तिष्ठसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ekeṣaṃviśvataḥ prāñcamapaśyannadhi tiṣṭhasi ||
Translation: Which thou hast fashioned mentally, onepoled but turning every way.

Sanskit Text: यं कुमार परावर्तयो रथं विप्रेभ्यस परि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ kumāra prāvartayo rathaṃ viprebhyas pari |
Translation: 4 The car which thou hast made to roll hitherward from the Sages, Child!

Sanskit Text: तंसामानु परावर्तत समितो नाव्याहितम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃsāmānu prāvartata samito nāvyāhitam ||
Translation: This hath the Sāman followed close, hence, laid together on a ship.

Sanskit Text: कः कुमारमजनयद रथं को निरवर्तयत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaḥ kumāramajanayad rathaṃ ko niravartayat |
Translation: 5 Who was the father of the child? Who made the chariot roll away?

Sanskit Text: कः सवित तदद्य नो बरूयादनुदेयी यथाभवत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kaḥ svit tadadya no brūyādanudeyī yathābhavat ||
Translation: Who will this day declare to us how the funeral gift was made?

Sanskit Text: यथाभवदनुदेयी ततो अग्रमजायत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathābhavadanudeyī tato aghramajāyata |
Translation: 6 When the funeral gift was placed, straightway the point of flame appeared.

Sanskit Text: पुरस्ताद बुध्नाततः पश्चान निरयणं कर्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: purastād budhnaātataḥ paścān nirayaṇaṃ kṛtam ||
Translation: A depth extended in the front: a passage out was made behind.

Sanskit Text: इदं यमस्य सादनं देवमानं यदुच्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ yamasya sādanaṃ devamānaṃ yaducyate |
Translation: 7 Here is the seat where Yama dwells, that which is called the Home of Gods:

Sanskit Text: इयमस्यधम्यते नाळीरयं गीर्भिः परिष्क्र्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iyamasyadhamyate nāḷīrayaṃ ghīrbhiḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ ||
Translation: Here minstrels blow the flute for him here he is glorified with songs.

Sanskit Text: केश्यग्निं केशी विषं केशी बिभर्ति रोदसी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: keśyaghniṃ keśī viṣaṃ keśī bibharti rodasī |
Translation: 1. HE with the long loose locks supports Agni, and moisture, heaven, and earth:

Sanskit Text: केशीविश्वं सवर्द्र्शे केशीदं जयोतिरुच्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: keśīviśvaṃ svardṛśe keśīdaṃ jyotirucyate ||
Translation: He is all sky to look upon: he with long hair is called this light.

Sanskit Text: मुनयो वातरशनाः पिशङगा वसते मला |
Sanskrit Transliteration: munayo vātaraśanāḥ piśaṅghā vasate malā |
Translation: 2 The Munis, girdled with the wind, wear garments soiled of yellow hue.

Sanskit Text: वातस्यानुध्राजिं यन्ति यद देवासो अविक्षत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vātasyānudhrājiṃ yanti yad devāso avikṣata ||
Translation: They, following the wind's swift course go where the Gods have gone before.

Sanskit Text: उन्मदिता मौनेयन वाताना तस्थिमा वयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: unmaditā mauneyana vātānā tasthimā vayam |
Translation: 3 Transported with our Munihood we have pressed on into the winds:

Sanskit Text: शरीरेदस्माकं यूयं मर्तासो अभि पश्यथ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śarīredasmākaṃ yūyaṃ martāso abhi paśyatha ||
Translation: You therefore, mortal men. behold our natural bodies and no more.

Sanskit Text: अन्तरिक्षेण पतति विश्वा रूपावचाकशत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: antarikṣeṇa patati viśvā rūpāvacākaśat |
Translation: 4 The Muni, made associate in the holy work of every God,

Sanskit Text: मुनिर्देवस्य-देवस्य सौक्र्त्याय सखा हितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: munirdevasya-devasya saukṛtyāya sakhā hitaḥ ||
Translation: Looking upon all varied forms flies through the region of the air.

Sanskit Text: वातस्याश्वो वायोः सखाथो देवेषितो मुनिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vātasyāśvo vāyoḥ sakhātho deveṣito muniḥ |
Translation: 5 The Steed of Vāta, Vāyu's friend, the Muni, by the Gods impelled,

Sanskit Text: उभौसमुद्रावा कषेति यश्च पूर्व उतापरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhausamudrāvā kṣeti yaśca pūrva utāparaḥ ||
Translation: In both the oceans hath his home, in eastern and in western sea.

Sanskit Text: अप्सरसां गन्धर्वाणां मर्गाणां चरणे चरन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apsarasāṃ ghandharvāṇāṃ mṛghāṇāṃ caraṇe caran |
Translation: 6 Treading the path of sylvan beasts, Gandharvas, and Apsarases,

Sanskit Text: केशीकेतस्य विद्वान सखा सवादुर्मदिन्तमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: keśīketasya vidvān sakhā svādurmadintamaḥ ||
Translation: He with long locks, who knows the wish, is a sweet most delightful friend

Sanskit Text: वायुरस्मा उपामन्थत पिनष्टि समा कुनन्नमा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāyurasmā upāmanthat pinaṣṭi smā kunannamā |
Translation: 7 Vāyu hath churned for him: for him he poundeth things most hard to bend,

Sanskit Text: केशीविषस्य पात्रेण यद रुद्रेणापिबत सह ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: keśīviṣasya pātreṇa yad rudreṇāpibat saha ||
Translation: When he with long loose locks hath drunk, with Rudra, water from the cup.

Sanskit Text: उत देवा अवहितं देवा उन नयथा पुनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta devā avahitaṃ devā un nayathā punaḥ |
Translation: 1. YE Gods, raise up once more the man whom ye have humbled and brought low.

Sanskit Text: उतागश्चक्रुषं देवा देवा जीवयथा पुनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utāghaścakruṣaṃ devā devā jīvayathā punaḥ ||
Translation: O Gods, restore to life again the man who hatb committed sin.

Sanskit Text: दवाविमौ वातौ वात आ सिन्धोरा परावतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dvāvimau vātau vāta ā sindhorā parāvataḥ |
Translation: 2 Two several winds are blowing here, from Sindhu, from a distant land.

Sanskit Text: दक्षन्ते अन्य आ वातु परान्यो वातु यद रपः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dakṣante anya ā vātu parānyo vātu yad rapaḥ ||
Translation: May one breathe energy to thee, the other blow disease away.

Sanskit Text: आ वात वाहि भेषजं वि वात वाहि यद रपः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāta vāhi bheṣajaṃ vi vāta vāhi yad rapaḥ |
Translation: 3 Hither, O Wind, blow healing balm, blow all disease away, thou Wind;

Sanskit Text: तवं हिविश्वभेषजो देवानां दूत ईयसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ hiviśvabheṣajo devānāṃ dūta īyase ||
Translation: For thou who hast all medicine comest as envoy of the Gods.

Sanskit Text: आ तवागमं शन्तातिभिरथो अरिष्टतातिभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tvāghamaṃ śantātibhiratho ariṣṭatātibhiḥ |
Translation: 4 I am come nigh to thee with balms to give thee rest and keep thee safe.

Sanskit Text: दक्षन्ते भद्रमाभार्षं परा यक्ष्मं सुवामि ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dakṣante bhadramābhārṣaṃ parā yakṣmaṃ suvāmi te ||
Translation: I bring thee blessed strength, I drive thy weakening malady away.

Sanskit Text: तरायन्तामिह देवास्त्रायतां मरुतां गणः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: trāyantāmiha devāstrāyatāṃ marutāṃ ghaṇaḥ |
Translation: 5 Here let the Gods deliver him, the Maruts’ band deliver him:

Sanskit Text: तरायन्तां विश्वा भूतानि यथायमरपा असत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: trāyantāṃ viśvā bhūtāni yathāyamarapā asat ||
Translation: All things that be deliver him that he be freed from his disease.

Sanskit Text: आप इद वा उ भेषजीरापो अमीवचातनीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpa id vā u bheṣajīrāpo amīvacātanīḥ |
Translation: 6 The Waters have their healing power, the Waters drive disease away.

Sanskit Text: आपःसर्वस्य भेषजीस्तास्ते कर्ण्वन्तु भेषजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āpaḥsarvasya bheṣajīstāste kṛṇvantu bheṣajam ||
Translation: The Waters have a balm for all: let them make medicine for thee.

Sanskit Text: हस्ताभ्यां दशशाखा भयां जिह्वा वाचः पुरोगवी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hastābhyāṃ daśaśākhā bhyāṃ jihvā vācaḥ puroghavī |
Translation: 7 The tongue that leads the voice precedes. Then with our ten-fold branching hands,

Sanskit Text: अनामयित्नुभ्यां तवा तभ्यां तवोप सप्र्शामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anāmayitnubhyāṃ tvā tabhyāṃ tvopa spṛśāmasi ||
Translation: With these two chasers of disease we stroke thee with a gentle touch.

Sanskit Text: तव तय इन्द्र सख्येषु वह्नय रतं मन्वाना वयदर्दिरुर्वलम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tava tya indra sakhyeṣu vahnaya ṛtaṃ manvānā vyadardirurvalam |
Translation: 1. ALLIED with thee in friendship, Indra, these, thy priests, remembering Holy Law, rent Vṛtra limb from limb,

Sanskit Text: यत्रा दशस्यन्नुषसो रिणन्नपः कुत्सायमन्मन्नह्यश्च दंसयः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatrā daśasyannuṣaso riṇannapaḥ kutsāyamanmannahyaśca daṃsayaḥ ||
Translation: When they bestowed the Dawns and let the waters flow, and when thou didst chastise dragons at Kutsa's call.

Sanskit Text: अवास्र्जः परस्वः शवञ्चयो गिरिनुदाज उस्रा अपिबोमधु परियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avāsṛjaḥ prasvaḥ śvañcayo ghirinudāja usrā apibomadhu priyam |
Translation: 2 Thou sentest forth productive powers, clavest the hills, thou dravest forth the kine, thou drankest pleasant meath.

Sanskit Text: अवर्धयो वनिनो अस्य दंससा शुशोचसूर्य रतजातया गिरा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: avardhayo vanino asya daṃsasā śuśocasūrya ṛtajātayā ghirā ||
Translation: Thou gavest increase through this Tree's surpassing might. The Sun shone by the hymn that sprang from Holy Law.

Sanskit Text: वि सूर्यो मध्ये अमुचद रथं दिवो विदद दासय परतिमानमार्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi sūryo madhye amucad rathaṃ divo vidad dāsaya pratimānamāryaḥ |
Translation: 3 In the mid-way of heaven the Sun unyoked his car: the Ārya found a match to meet his Dam foe.

Sanskit Text: दर्ळानि पिप्रोरसुरस्य मायिन इन्द्रो वयास्यच्चक्र्वान रजिश्वना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dṛḷāni piprorasurasya māyina indro vyāsyaccakṛvān ṛjiśvanā ||
Translation: Associate with Ṛjiśvan Indra overthrew the solid forts of Pipru, conjuring Asura.

Sanskit Text: अनाध्र्ष्टानि धर्षितो वयास्यन निधीन्रदेवानम्र्णदयास्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anādhṛṣṭāni dhṛṣito vyāsyan nidhīnradevānamṛṇadayāsyaḥ |
Translation: 4 He boldly cast down forts which none had e’er assailed: unwearied he destroycd the godless treasure-stores.

Sanskit Text: मासेव सूर्यो वसु पुर्यमा ददे गर्णानःशत्रून्रश्र्णाद विरुक्मता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: māseva sūryo vasu puryamā dade ghṛṇānaḥśatrūnraśṛṇād virukmatā ||
Translation: Like Sun and Moon he took the stronghold's wealth away, and, praised in song, demolished foes with flashing dart.

Sanskit Text: अयुद्धसेनो विभ्वा विभिन्दता दाशद वर्त्रहा तुज्यानि तेजते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayuddhaseno vibhvā vibhindatā dāśad vṛtrahā tujyāni tejate |
Translation: 5 Armed with resistless weapons, with vast power to cleave, the Vṛtra-slayer whets his darts and deals fordi wounds.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्य वज्रादबिभेदभिश्नथः पराक्रामच्छुन्ध्युरजहदुष अनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasya vajrādabibhedabhiśnathaḥ prākrāmacchundhyurajahaduṣa anaḥ ||
Translation: Bright Uṣas was afraid of Indra's slaughtering bolt: she went upon her way and left her chariot there.

Sanskit Text: एता तया ते शरुत्यानि केवला यदेक एकमक्र्णोरयज्ञम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: etā tyā te śrutyāni kevalā yadeka ekamakṛṇorayajñam |
Translation: 6 These are thy famous exploits, only thine, when thou alone hast left the other reft of sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: मासां विधानमदधा अधि दयवि तवया विभिन्नम्भरति परधिं पिता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: māsāṃ vidhānamadadhā adhi dyavi tvayā vibhinnambharati pradhiṃ pitā ||
Translation: Thou in the heavens hast set the ordering of the Moons: the Father bears the felly portioned out by thee.

Sanskit Text: सूर्यरश्मिर्हरिकेशः पुरस्तात सविता जयोतिरुदयानजस्रम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūryaraśmirharikeśaḥ purastāt savitā jyotirudayānajasram |
Translation: 1. SAVITAR, golden-haired, hath lifted eastward, bright With the sunbeams, his eternal lustre;

Sanskit Text: तस्य पूषा परसवे याति विद्वान सम्पश्यन्विश्वा भुवनानि गोपाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasya pūṣā prasave yāti vidvān sampaśyanviśvā bhuvanāni ghopāḥ ||
Translation: He in whose energy wise Pūṣan marches, surveying all existence like a herdsman.

Sanskit Text: नर्चक्षा एष दिवो मध्य आस्त आपप्रिवान रोदसीन्तरिक्षम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nṛcakṣā eṣa divo madhya āsta āpaprivān rodasīantarikṣam |
Translation: 2 Beholding men he sits amid the heaven filling the two world-halves and air's wide region.

Sanskit Text: स विश्वाचीरभि चष्टे घर्ताचीरन्तरापूर्वमपरं च केतुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa viśvācīrabhi caṣṭe ghṛtācīrantarāpūrvamaparaṃ ca ketum ||
Translation: He looks upon the rich far-spreading pastures between the eastern and the western limit.

Sanskit Text: रायो बुध्नः संगमनो वसूनां विश्वा रूपाभि चष्टेशचीभिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: rāyo budhnaḥ saṃghamano vasūnāṃ viśvā rūpābhi caṣṭeśacībhiḥ |
Translation: 3 He, root of wealth, the gatherer-up of treasures, looks with his might on every form and figure.

Sanskit Text: देव इव सविता सत्यधर्मेन्द्रो न तस्थौसमरे धनानाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: deva iva savitā satyadharmendro na tasthausamare dhanānām ||
Translation: Savitar, like a Godẉhose Law is constant, stands in the battle for the spoil like Indra.

Sanskit Text: विश्वावसुं सोम गन्धर्वमापो दद्र्शुषीस्तद रतेना वयायन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāvasuṃ soma ghandharvamāpo dadṛśuṣīstad ṛtenā vyāyan |
Translation: 4 Waters from sacrifice came to the Gandharva Visvavasu, O Soma, when they saw him.

Sanskit Text: तदन्ववैदिन्द्रो रारहाण आसां परि सुर्यस्यपरिधिन्रपश्यत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadanvavaidindro rārahāṇa āsāṃ pari suryasyaparidhinrapaśyat ||
Translation: Indra, approaching quickly, marked their going, and looked around upon the Sun's enclosures.

Sanskit Text: विश्वावसुरभि तन नो गर्णातु दिव्यो गन्धर्वो रजसोविमानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvāvasurabhi tan no ghṛṇātu divyo ghandharvo rajasovimānaḥ |
Translation: 5 This song Visvavasu shall sing us, meter of air's mid-realm celestial Gandharva,

Sanskit Text: यद वा घा सत्यमुत यन न विद्म धियोहिन्वानो धिय इन नो अव्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad vā ghā satyamuta yan na vidma dhiyohinvāno dhiya in no avyāḥ ||
Translation: That we may know aright both truth and falsehood: may he inspire our thoughts and help our praises.

Sanskit Text: सस्निमविन्दच्चरणे नदीनामपाव्र्णोद दुरो अश्मव्रजानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sasnimavindaccaraṇe nadīnāmapāvṛṇod duro aśmavrajānām |
Translation: 6 In the floods' track he found the bootyseeker: the rocky cow-pen's doors he threw wide open.

Sanskit Text: परासां गन्धर्वो अम्र्तानि वोचदिन्द्रो दक्षं परि जानादहीनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāsāṃ ghandharvo amṛtāni vocadindro dakṣaṃ pari jānādahīnām ||
Translation: These, the Gandharva told him, Rowed with Amṛta. Indra knew well the puissancc of the dragons.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने तव शरवो वयो महि भराजन्ते अर्चयो विभावसो |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne tava śravo vayo mahi bhrājante arcayo vibhāvaso |
Translation: 1. AGNI, life-power and fame are thine: thy fires blaze mightily, thou rich in wealth of beams!

Sanskit Text: बर्हद्भानो शवसा वाजमुक्थ्यं दधासि दाशुषे कवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhadbhāno śavasā vājamukthyaṃ dadhāsi dāśuṣe kave ||
Translation: Sage, passing bright, thou givest to the worshipper, with strength, the food that merits laud.

Sanskit Text: पावकवर्चाः शुक्रवर्चा अनूनवर्चा उदियर्षि भानुना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāvakavarcāḥ śukravarcā anūnavarcā udiyarṣi bhānunā |
Translation: 2 With brilliant, purifying sheen, with perfect sheen thou liftest up thyself in light.

Sanskit Text: पुत्रो मातरा विचरन्नुपावसि पर्णक्षि रोदसी उभे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: putro mātarā vicarannupāvasi pṛṇakṣi rodasī ubhe ||
Translation: Thou, visiting both thy Mothers, aidest them as Son: thou joinest close the earth and heaven.

Sanskit Text: ऊर्जो नपाज्जातवेदः सुशस्तिभिर्मन्दस्व धीतिभिर्हितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrjo napājjātavedaḥ suśastibhirmandasva dhītibhirhitaḥ |
Translation: 3 O Jātavedas, Son of Strength, rejoice ihyself, gracious, in our fair hymns and songs.

Sanskit Text: तवे इषः सं दधुर्भूरिवर्पसश्चित्रोतयो वामजाताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tve iṣaḥ saṃ dadhurbhūrivarpasaścitrotayo vāmajātāḥ ||
Translation: In thee are treasured various forms of strengthening food, born nobly and of wondrous help.

Sanskit Text: इरज्यन्नग्ने परथयस्व जन्तुभिरस्मे रायो अमर्त्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: irajyannaghne prathayasva jantubhirasme rāyo amartya |
Translation: 4 Agni, spread forth, as Ruler, over living things: give wealth to us, Immortal God.

Sanskit Text: सदर्शतस्य वपुषो वि राजसि पर्णक्षि सानसिं करतुम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadarśatasya vapuṣo vi rājasi pṛṇakṣi sānasiṃ kratum ||
Translation: Thou shinest out from beauty fair to look upon: thou leadest us to conquering power.

Sanskit Text: इष्कर्तारमध्वरस्य परचेतसं कषयन्तं राधसो महः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: iṣkartāramadhvarasya pracetasaṃ kṣayantaṃ rādhaso mahaḥ |
Translation: 5 To him, the wise, who orders sacrifice, who hath great riches un der his control,

Sanskit Text: रातिं वामस्य सुभगां महीमिषं दधासि सानसिंरयिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: rātiṃ vāmasya subhaghāṃ mahīmiṣaṃ dadhāsi sānasiṃrayim ||
Translation: Thou givest blest award of good, and plenteous food, givest him wealth that conquers all.

Sanskit Text: रतावानं महिषं विश्वदर्शतमग्निं सुम्नाय दधिरेपुरो जनाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtāvānaṃ mahiṣaṃ viśvadarśatamaghniṃ sumnāya dadhirepuro janāḥ |
Translation: 6 The men have set before them them for their welfare Agni, strong, visible to all, the Holy.

Sanskit Text: शरुत्कर्णं सप्रथस्तमं तवा गिरा दैव्यम्मानुषा युगा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrutkarṇaṃ saprathastamaṃ tvā ghirā daivyammānuṣā yughā ||
Translation: Thee, Godlike One, with ears to hear, most famous, men's generations magnify with praise-songs.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने अछा वदेह नः परत्यं नः सुमना भव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne achā vadeha naḥ pratyaṃ naḥ sumanā bhava |
Translation: 1. TURN hither, Agni, speak to us: come to us with a gracious mind.

Sanskit Text: पर नोयछ विशस पते धनदा असि नस्त्वम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra noyacha viśas pate dhanadā asi nastvam ||
Translation: Enrich us, Master of the house: thou art the Giver of our wealth.

Sanskit Text: पर नो यछत्वर्यमा पर भगः पर बर्हस्पतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra no yachatvaryamā pra bhaghaḥ pra bṛhaspatiḥ |
Translation: 2 Let Aryarnan vouchsafe us wealth, and Bhaga, and Bṛhaspati.

Sanskit Text: परदेवाः परोत सून्र्ता रायो देवी ददातु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pradevāḥ prota sūnṛtā rāyo devī dadātu naḥ ||
Translation: Let the Gods give their gifts, and let Sūnṛtā, Goddess, grant us wealth.

Sanskit Text: सोमं राजानमवसे.अग्निं गीर्भिर्हवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somaṃ rājānamavase.aghniṃ ghīrbhirhavāmahe |
Translation: 3 We call King Soma to our aid, and Agni with our songs and hymns,

Sanskit Text: आदित्यान्विष्णुं सूर्यं बरह्माणं च बर्हस्पतिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityānviṣṇuṃ sūryaṃ brahmāṇaṃ ca bṛhaspatim ||
Translation: Ādityas, Viṣṇu, Sūrya, and the Brahman Priest Bṛhaspati.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रवायू बर्हस्पतिं सुहवेह हवामहे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indravāyū bṛhaspatiṃ suhaveha havāmahe |
Translation: 4 Indra, Vāyu, Bṛhaspati, Gods swift to listen, we invoke,

Sanskit Text: यथा नः सर्वैज्जनः संगत्यां सुमना असत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā naḥ sarvaijjanaḥ saṃghatyāṃ sumanā asat ||
Translation: That in the synod all the folk may be benevolent to us.

Sanskit Text: अर्यमणं बर्हस्पतिमिन्द्रं दानाय चोदय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aryamaṇaṃ bṛhaspatimindraṃ dānāya codaya |
Translation: 5 Urge Aryaman to send us gifts, and Indra, and Bṛhaspati,

Sanskit Text: वातंविष्णुं सरस्वतीं सवितारं च वाजिनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vātaṃviṣṇuṃ sarasvatīṃ savitāraṃ ca vājinam ||
Translation: Vāta, Viṣṇu, Sarasvatī and the Strong Courser Savitar.

Sanskit Text: तवं नो अग्ने अग्निभिर्ब्रह्म यज्ञं च वर्धय |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ no aghne aghnibhirbrahma yajñaṃ ca vardhaya |
Translation: 6 Do thou, O Agni, with thy fires strengthen our prayer and sacrifice:

Sanskit Text: तवं नोदेवतातये रायो दानाय चोदय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ nodevatātaye rāyo dānāya codaya ||
Translation: Urge givers to bestow their wealth to aid our service of the Gods.

Sanskit Text: अयमग्ने जरिता तवे अभूदपि सहसः सूनो नह्यन्यदस्त्याप्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayamaghne jaritā tve abhūdapi sahasaḥ sūno nahyanyadastyāpyam |
Translation: 1. WITH thee, O Agni, was this singer of the laud: he hath no other kinship, O thou Son of Strength.

Sanskit Text: भद्रं हि शर्म तरिवरूथमस्ति त आरेहिंसानामप दिद्युमा कर्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadraṃ hi śarma trivarūthamasti ta ārehiṃsānāmapa didyumā kṛdhi ||
Translation: Thou givest blessed shelter with a triple guard. Keep the destructive lightning far away from us.

Sanskit Text: परवत ते अग्ने जनिमा पितूयतः साचीव विश्वा भुवना नय्र्ञ्जसे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pravat te aghne janimā pitūyataḥ sācīva viśvā bhuvanā nyṛñjase |
Translation: 2 Thy birth who seekest food is in the falling flood, Agni: as Comrade thou winnest all living things.

Sanskit Text: पर सप्तयः पर सनिषन्त नो धियः पुरश्चरन्तिपशुपा इव तमना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra saptayaḥ pra saniṣanta no dhiyaḥ puraścarantipaśupā iva tmanā ||
Translation: Our coursers and our songs shall be victorious: they of themselves advance like one who guards the herd.

Sanskit Text: उत वा उ परि वर्णक्षि बप्सद बहोरग्न उलपस्य सवधावः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta vā u pari vṛṇakṣi bapsad bahoraghna ulapasya svadhāvaḥ |
Translation: 3 And thou, O Agni, thou of Godlike nature, sparest the stones, while caring up the brushwood.

Sanskit Text: उत खिल्या उर्वराणां भवन्ति मा ते हेतिं तविषींचुक्रुधाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta khilyā urvarāṇāṃ bhavanti mā te hetiṃ taviṣīṃcukrudhāma ||
Translation: Then are thy tracks like deserts in the corn-lands. Let us not stir to wrath thy mighty arrow.

Sanskit Text: यदुद्वतो निवतो यासि बप्सत पर्थगेषि परगर्धिनीवसेना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadudvato nivato yāsi bapsat pṛthagheṣi praghardhinīvasenā |
Translation: 4 O'er hills through vales devouring as thou goest, thou partest like an army fain for booty

Sanskit Text: यदा ते वातो अनुवाति शोचिर्वप्तेव शमश्रु वपसिप्र भूम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadā te vāto anuvāti śocirvapteva śmaśru vapasipra bhūma ||
Translation: As when a barber shaves a beard, thou shavest earth when the wind blows on thy flame and fans it.

Sanskit Text: परत्यस्य शरेणयो दद्र्श्र एकं नियानं बहवो रथासः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratyasya śreṇayo dadṛśra ekaṃ niyānaṃ bahavo rathāsaḥ |
Translation: 5 Apparent are his lines as he approaches the course is single, but the cars are many,

Sanskit Text: बाहू यदग्ने अनुमर्म्र्जानो नयंं उत्तानामन्वेषिभूमिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bāhū yadaghne anumarmṛjāno nyaṃṃ uttānāmanveṣibhūmim ||
Translation: When, Agni, thou, making thine arms resplendent, advancest o’er the land spread out beneath thee.

Sanskit Text: उत ते शुष्मा जिहतामुत ते अर्चिरुत ते अग्ने शशमानस्यवाजाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut te śuṣmā jihatāmut te arcirut te aghne śaśamānasyavājāḥ |
Translation: 6 Now let thy strength, thy burning flames fly upward, thine energies, O Agni, as thou toilest.

Sanskit Text: उच्छ्वञ्चस्व नि नम वर्धमान आ तवाद्य विश्वेवसवः सदन्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ucchvañcasva ni nama vardhamāna ā tvādya viśvevasavaḥ sadantu ||
Translation: Gape widely, bend thee, waxing in thy vigour: let all the Vasus sit this day beside thee.

Sanskit Text: अपामिदं नययनं समुद्रस्य निवेशनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāmidaṃ nyayanaṃ samudrasya niveśanam |
Translation: 7 This is the waters' reservoir, the great abode of gathered streams.

Sanskit Text: अन्यंक्र्णुष्वेतः पन्थां तेन याहि वशाननु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: anyaṃkṛṇuṣvetaḥ panthāṃ tena yāhi vaśānanu ||
Translation: Take thou another path than this, and as thou listest walk thereon.

Sanskit Text: आयने ते परायणे दूर्वा रोहन्तु पुष्पिणिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āyane te parāyaṇe dūrvā rohantu puṣpiṇiḥ |
Translation: 8 On thy way hitherward and hence let flowery Durva grass spring up

Sanskit Text: हरदाश्चपुण्डरीकाणि समुद्रस्य गर्हा इमे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hradāścapuṇḍarīkāṇi samudrasya ghṛhā ime ||
Translation: Let there be lakes with lotus blooms. These are the mansions of the flood.

Sanskit Text: तयं चिदत्रिं रतजुरमर्थमश्वं न यातवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tyaṃ cidatriṃ ṛtajuramarthamaśvaṃ na yātave |
Translation: 1. YE made that Atri, worn with eld, free as a horse to win the goal.

Sanskit Text: कक्षिवन्तं यदी पुना रथं न कर्णुथो नवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kakṣivantaṃ yadī punā rathaṃ na kṛṇutho navam ||
Translation: When ye restored to youth and strength Kakṣīvān like a car renewed,

Sanskit Text: तयं चिदश्वं न वाजिनमरेणवो यमत्नत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tyaṃ cidaśvaṃ na vājinamareṇavo yamatnata |
Translation: 2 Ye freed that Atri like a horse, and brought him newly-born to earth.

Sanskit Text: दर्ळंग्रन्थिं न वि षयतमत्रिं यविष्ठमा रजः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dṛḷaṃghranthiṃ na vi ṣyatamatriṃ yaviṣṭhamā rajaḥ ||
Translation: Ye loosed him like a firm-tied knot which Gods unsoiled by dust had bound.

Sanskit Text: नरा दंसिष्ठवत्रये शुभ्रा सिषासतं धियः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: narā daṃsiṣṭhavatraye śubhrā siṣāsataṃ dhiyaḥ |
Translation: 3 Heroes who showed most wondrous power to Atri, strive to win fair songs;

Sanskit Text: अथा हि वां दिवो नरा पुन सतोमो न विशसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā hi vāṃ divo narā puna stomo na viśase ||
Translation: For then, O Heroes of the sky, your hymn of praise shall cease no more.

Sanskit Text: चिते तद वां सुराधसा रातिः सुमतिरश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: cite tad vāṃ surādhasā rātiḥ sumatiraśvinā |
Translation: 4 This claims your notice, Bounteous Gods! - oblation, Aśvins! and our love,

Sanskit Text: आ यन्नः सदने पर्थौ समने पर्षथो नरा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yannaḥ sadane pṛthau samane parṣatho narā ||
Translation: That ye, O Heroes, in the fight may bring us safe to ample room.

Sanskit Text: युवं भुज्युं समुद्र आ रजसः पार ईङखितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yuvaṃ bhujyuṃ samudra ā rajasaḥ pāra īṅkhitam |
Translation: 5 Ye Twain to Bhujyu tossed about in ocean at the region's end,

Sanskit Text: यातमछा पतत्रिभिर्नासत्या सातये कर्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yātamachā patatribhirnāsatyā sātaye kṛtam ||
Translation: Nāsatyas, with your winged sterds came nigh, and gave him strength to win.

Sanskit Text: आ वां सुम्नैः शम्यू इव मंहिष्ठा विश्ववेदसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā vāṃ sumnaiḥ śamyū iva maṃhiṣṭhā viśvavedasā |
Translation: 6 Come with your joys, most liberal Gods, Lords of all treasures, bringing weal.

Sanskit Text: समस्मे भूषतं नरोत्सं न पिप्युषीरिषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samasme bhūṣataṃ narotsaṃ na pipyuṣīriṣaḥ ||
Translation: Like fresh full waters to a well, so, Heroes come and be with us.

Sanskit Text: अयं हि ते अमर्त्य इन्दुरत्यो न पत्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ hi te amartya induratyo na patyate |
Translation: 1. THIS deathless Indu, like a steed, strong and of full vitality,

Sanskit Text: दक्षो विश्वायुर्वेधसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dakṣo viśvāyurvedhase ||
Translation: Belongs to thee, the Orderer.

Sanskit Text: अयमस्मासु काव्य रभुर्वज्रो दास्वते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayamasmāsu kāvya ṛbhurvajro dāsvate |
Translation: 2 Here, by us, for the worshipper, is the wise bolt that works with skill.

Sanskit Text: अयं बिभर्त्यूर्ध्वक्र्शनं मदं रभुर्न कर्त्व्यं मदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayaṃ bibhartyūrdhvakṛśanaṃ madaṃ ṛbhurna kṛtvyaṃ madam ||
Translation: It brings the bubbling beverage as a dexterous man brings the effectual strong drink.

Sanskit Text: घर्षुः शयेनाय कर्त्वन आसु सवासु वंसगः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghṛṣuḥ śyenāya kṛtvana āsu svāsu vaṃsaghaḥ |
Translation: 3 Impetuous Ahīśuva, a bull among cows of his,

Sanskit Text: अव दीधेदहीशुवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ava dīdhedahīśuvaḥ ||
Translation: looked down upon the restless Hawk.

Sanskit Text: यं सुपर्णः परावतः शयेनस्य पुत्र आभरत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ suparṇaḥ parāvataḥ śyenasya putra ābharat |
Translation: 4 That the strong-pinioned Bird hath brought, Child of the Falcon, from afar,

Sanskit Text: शतचक्रं यो.अह्यो वर्तनिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śatacakraṃ yo.ahyo vartaniḥ ||
Translation: What moves upon a hundred wheels along the female Dragon's path.

Sanskit Text: यं ते शयेनश्चारुमव्र्कं पदाभरदरुणं मानमन्धसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaṃ te śyenaścārumavṛkaṃ padābharadaruṇaṃ mānamandhasaḥ |
Translation: 5 Which, fair, unrobbed, the Falcon brought thee in his foot, the red-hued dwelling of the juice;

Sanskit Text: एना वयो वि तार्यायुर्जीवस एना जागारबन्धुता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: enā vayo vi tāryāyurjīvasa enā jāghārabandhutā ||
Translation: Through this came vital power which lengthens out our days, and kinship through its help awoke.

Sanskit Text: एवा तदिन्द्र इन्दुना देवेषु चिद धारयाते महि तयजः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā tadindra indunā deveṣu cid dhārayāte mahi tyajaḥ |
Translation: 6 So Indra is by lndu's power; e’en among Gods will it repel great treachery.

Sanskit Text: करत्वा वयो वि तार्यायुः सुक्रतो करत्वायमस्मदासुतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kratvā vayo vi tāryāyuḥ sukrato kratvāyamasmadāsutaḥ ||
Translation: Wisdom, Most Sapient One, brings force that lengthens life. May wisdom bring the juice to us.

Sanskit Text: इमां खनाम्योषधिं वीरुधं बलवत्तमाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imāṃ khanāmyoṣadhiṃ vīrudhaṃ balavattamām |
Translation: 1. FROM out the earth I dig this plant, a herb of most effectual power,

Sanskit Text: ययासपत्नीं बाधते यया संविन्दते पतिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayāsapatnīṃ bādhate yayā saṃvindate patim ||
Translation: Wherewith one quells the rival wife and gains the husband for oneself.

Sanskit Text: उत्तानपर्णे सुभगे देवजूते सहस्वति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uttānaparṇe subhaghe devajūte sahasvati |
Translation: 2 Auspicious, with expanded leaves, sent by the Gods, victorious plant,

Sanskit Text: सपत्नीं मे पराधम पतिं मे केवलं कुरु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sapatnīṃ me parādhama patiṃ me kevalaṃ kuru ||
Translation: Blow thou the rival wife away, and make my husband only mine.

Sanskit Text: उत्तराहमुत्तर उत्तरेदुत्तराभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uttarāhamuttara uttareduttarābhyaḥ |
Translation: 3 Stronger am 1, O Stronger One, yea, mightier than the mightier;

Sanskit Text: अथा सपत्नी याममाधरा साधराभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: athā sapatnī yāmamādharā sādharābhyaḥ ||
Translation: And she who is my rival wife is lower than the lowest dames.

Sanskit Text: नह्यस्या नाम गर्भ्णामि नो अस्मिन रमते जने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: nahyasyā nāma ghṛbhṇāmi no asmin ramate jane |
Translation: 4 Her very name I utter not: she takes no pleasure in this man.

Sanskit Text: परामेवपरावतं सपत्नीं गमयामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: parāmevaparāvataṃ sapatnīṃ ghamayāmasi ||
Translation: Far into distance most remote drive we the rival wife away.

Sanskit Text: अहमस्मि सहमानाथ तवमसि सासहिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahamasmi sahamānātha tvamasi sāsahiḥ |
Translation: 5 I am the conqueror, and thou, thou also act victorious:

Sanskit Text: उभे सहस्वतीभूत्वी सपत्नीं मे सहावहै ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhe sahasvatībhūtvī sapatnīṃ me sahāvahai ||
Translation: As victory attends us both we will subdue my fellow-wife.

Sanskit Text: उप ते.अधां सहमानामभि तवाधां सहीयसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: upa te.adhāṃ sahamānāmabhi tvādhāṃ sahīyasā |
Translation: 6 I have gained thee for vanquisher, have grasped thee with a stronger spell.

Sanskit Text: मामनुप्र ते मनो वत्सं गौरिव धावतु पथा वारिव धावतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: māmanupra te mano vatsaṃ ghauriva dhāvatu pathā vāriva dhāvatu ||
Translation: As a cow hastens to her calf, so let thy spirit speed te me, hasten like water on its way.

Sanskit Text: अरण्यान्यरण्यान्यसौ या परेव नश्यसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: araṇyānyaraṇyānyasau yā preva naśyasi |
Translation: 1. GODDESS of wild and forest who seemest to vanish from the sight.

Sanskit Text: कथाग्रामं न पर्छसि न तवा भीरिव विन्दती.अ.अ.अन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kathāghrāmaṃ na pṛchasi na tvā bhīriva vindatī.a.a.an ||
Translation: How is it that thou seekest not the village? Art thou not afraid?

Sanskit Text: वर्षारवाय वदते यदुपावति चिच्चिकः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣāravāya vadate yadupāvati ciccikaḥ |
Translation: 2 What time the grasshopper replies and swells the shrill cicala's voice,

Sanskit Text: आघाटिभिरिवधावयन्नरण्यानिर्महीयते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āghāṭibhirivadhāvayannaraṇyānirmahīyate ||
Translation: Seeming to sound with tinkling bells, the Lady of the Wood exults.

Sanskit Text: उत गाव इवादन्त्युत वेश्मेव दर्श्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta ghāva ivādantyuta veśmeva dṛśyate |
Translation: 3 And, yonder, cattle seem to graze, what seems a dwelling-place appears:

Sanskit Text: उतो अरण्यानिःसायं शकटीरिव सर्जति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uto araṇyāniḥsāyaṃ śakaṭīriva sarjati ||
Translation: Or else at eve the Lady of the Forest seems to free the wains.

Sanskit Text: गामङगैष आ हवयति दार्वङगैषो अपावधीत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāmaṅghaiṣa ā hvayati dārvaṅghaiṣo apāvadhīt |
Translation: 4 Here one is calling to his cow, another there hath felled a tree:

Sanskit Text: वसन्नरण्यान्यां सायमक्रुक्षदिति मन्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vasannaraṇyānyāṃ sāyamakrukṣaditi manyate ||
Translation: At eve the dweller in the wood fancies that somebody hath screamed.

Sanskit Text: न वा अरण्यानिर्हन्त्यन्यश्चेन नाभिगछति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: na vā araṇyānirhantyanyaścen nābhighachati |
Translation: 5 The Goddess never slays, unless some murderous enemy approach.

Sanskit Text: सवादोःफलस्य जग्ध्वाय यथाकामं नि पद्यते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: svādoḥphalasya jaghdhvāya yathākāmaṃ ni padyate ||
Translation: Man eats of savoury fruit and then takes, even as he wills, his rest.

Sanskit Text: आञ्जनगन्धिं सुरभिं बह्वन्नामक्र्षीवलाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āñjanaghandhiṃ surabhiṃ bahvannāmakṛṣīvalām |
Translation: 6 Now have I praised the Forest Queen, sweet-scented, redolent of balm,

Sanskit Text: पराहम्म्र्गाणां मातरमरण्यानिमशंसिषम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāhammṛghāṇāṃ mātaramaraṇyānimaśaṃsiṣam ||
Translation: The Mother of all sylvan things, who tills not but hath stores of food.

Sanskit Text: शरत ते दधामि परथमाय मन्यवे.अहन यद वर्त्रं नर्यंविवेरपः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrat te dadhāmi prathamāya manyave.ahan yad vṛtraṃ naryaṃviverapaḥ |
Translation: 1. I TRUST in thy first wrathful deed, O Indra, when thou slewest Vṛtra and didst work to profit man;

Sanskit Text: उभे यत तवा भवतो रोदसी अनु रेजतेशुष्मात पर्थिवी चिदद्रिवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ubhe yat tvā bhavato rodasī anu rejateśuṣmāt pṛthivī cidadrivaḥ ||
Translation: What time the two world-halves fell short of thee in might, and the earth trembled at thy force, O Thunder-anned.

Sanskit Text: तवं मायाभिरनवद्य मायिनं शरवस्यता मनसा वर्त्रमर्दयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ māyābhiranavadya māyinaṃ śravasyatā manasā vṛtramardayaḥ |
Translation: 2 Thou with thy magic powers didst rend the conjurer Vṛtra, O Blameless One, with heart that longed for fame.

Sanskit Text: तवमिन नरो वर्णते गविष्टिषु तवां विश्वासुहव्यास्विष्टिषु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamin naro vṛṇate ghaviṣṭiṣu tvāṃ viśvāsuhavyāsviṣṭiṣu ||
Translation: Heroes elect thee when they battle for the prey, thee in all sacrifices worthy of renown.

Sanskit Text: ऐषु चाकन्धि पुरुहूत सूरिषु वर्धासो ये मघवन्नानशुर्मघम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aiṣu cākandhi puruhūta sūriṣu vṛdhāso ye maghavannānaśurmagham |
Translation: 3 God Much-invoked, take pleasure in these princes here, who, thine exalters, Maghavan, have come to wealth.

Sanskit Text: अर्चन्ति तोके तनये परिष्टिषु मेधसाता वाजिनमह्रये धने ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arcanti toke tanaye pariṣṭiṣu medhasātā vājinamahraye dhane ||
Translation: In synods, when the rite succeeds, they hymn the Strong for sons and progeny and riches undisturbed.

Sanskit Text: स इन नु रायः सुभ्र्तस्य चाकनन मदं यो अस्य रंह्यंचिकेतति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa in nu rāyaḥ subhṛtasya cākanan madaṃ yo asya raṃhyaṃciketati |
Translation: 4 That man shall find delight in well-protected wealth whose care provides for him the quick-sought joyous draught.

Sanskit Text: तवाव्र्धो मघवन दाश्वध्वरो मक्षू स वाजम्भरते धना नर्भिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāvṛdho maghavan dāśvadhvaro makṣū sa vājambharate dhanā nṛbhiḥ ||
Translation: Bringing oblations, strengthened Maghavan, by thee, he swiftly wins the spoil with heroes in the fight.

Sanskit Text: तवं शर्धाय महिना गर्णान उरु कर्धि मघवञ्छग्धिरायः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ śardhāya mahinā ghṛṇāna uru kṛdhi maghavañchaghdhirāyaḥ |
Translation: 5 Now for our band, O Maghavan, when lauded, make ample room with might, and grant us riches.

Sanskit Text: तवं नो मित्रो वरुणो न मायी पित्वो न दस्मदयसे विभक्ता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ no mitro varuṇo na māyī pitvo na dasmadayase vibhaktā ||
Translation: Magician thou, our Varuṇa and Mitra, deal food to us, O Wondrous, as Dispenser.

Sanskit Text: सुष्वाणास इन्द्र सतुमसि तवा ससवांसश्च तुविन्र्म्णवाजम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: suṣvāṇāsa indra stumasi tvā sasavāṃsaśca tuvinṛmṇavājam |
Translation: 1. WHEN we have pressed the juice we laud thee, Indra, and when, Most Valorous we have won the booty.

Sanskit Text: आ नो भर सुवितं यस्य चाकन तमना तनासनुयाम तवोताः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā no bhara suvitaṃ yasya cākan tmanā tanāsanuyāma tvotāḥ ||
Translation: Bring us prosperity, as each desires it under thine own protection may we conquer.

Sanskit Text: रष्वस्त्वमिन्द्र शूर जातो दासीर्विशः सूर्येणसह्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṣvastvamindra śūra jāto dāsīrviśaḥ sūryeṇasahyāḥ |
Translation: 2 Sublime from birth, mayst thou O Indra, Hero, with Sūrya overcome the Dāsa races.

Sanskit Text: गुहा हितं गुह्यं गूळमप्सु बिभ्र्मसिप्रस्रवणे न सोमम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghuhā hitaṃ ghuhyaṃ ghūḷamapsu bibhṛmasiprasravaṇe na somam ||
Translation: As by a fountain's side, we bring the Soma that lay concealed, close-hidden in the waters.

Sanskit Text: अर्यो वा गिरो अभ्यर्च विद्वान रषीणां विप्रः सुमतिंचकानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aryo vā ghiro abhyarca vidvān ṛṣīṇāṃ vipraḥ sumatiṃcakānaḥ |
Translation: 3 Answer the votary's hymns, for these thou knowest, craving the Ṛṣis’ prayer, thyself a Singer

Sanskit Text: ते सयाम ये रणयन्त सोमैरेनोत तुभ्यंरथोळ भक्षैः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: te syāma ye raṇayanta somairenota tubhyaṃrathoḷa bhakṣaiḥ ||
Translation: May we be they who take delight in Somas: these with sweet food for thee, O Chariot-rider.

Sanskit Text: इमा बरह्मेन्द्र तुभ्यं शंसि दा नर्भ्यो नर्णां शूरशवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā brahmendra tubhyaṃ śaṃsi dā nṛbhyo nṛṇāṃ śūraśavaḥ |
Translation: 4 These holy prayers, O Indra, have I sung thee: grant to the men the strength of men, thou Hero.

Sanskit Text: तेभिर्भव सक्रतुर्येषु चाकन्नुत तरायस्वग्र्णत उत सतीन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tebhirbhava sakraturyeṣu cākannuta trāyasvaghṛṇata uta stīn ||
Translation: Be of one mind with those in whom thou joyest: keep thou the singers safe and their companions.

Sanskit Text: शरुधी हवमिन्द्र शूर पर्थ्या उत सतवसे वेन्यस्यार्कैः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrudhī havamindra śūra pṛthyā uta stavase venyasyārkaiḥ |
Translation: 5 Listen to Pṛthi's call, heroic Indra, and be thou lauded by the hymns of Venya,

Sanskit Text: आ यस्ते योनिं घर्तवन्तमस्वारूर्मिर्न निम्नैर्द्रवयन्त वक्वाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yaste yoniṃ ghṛtavantamasvārūrmirna nimnairdravayanta vakvāḥ ||
Translation: Him who hath sung thee to thine oil-rich dwelling, whose rolling songs have sped thee like a torrent.

Sanskit Text: सविता यन्त्रैः पर्थिवीमरम्णादस्कम्भने सविता दयामद्रंहत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: savitā yantraiḥ pṛthivīmaramṇādaskambhane savitā dyāmadṛṃhat |
Translation: 1. SAVITAR fixed the earth with bands to bind it, and made heaven stedfast where no prop supported.

Sanskit Text: अश्वमिवाधुक्षद धुनिमन्तरिक्षमतूर्तेबद्धं सविता समुद्रम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvamivādhukṣad dhunimantarikṣamatūrtebaddhaṃ savitā samudram ||
Translation: Savitar milked, as ’twere a restless courser, air, sea bound fast to what no foot had trodden.

Sanskit Text: यत्रा समुद्र सकभितो वयौनदपां नपात सविता तस्यवेद |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yatrā samudra skabhito vyaunadapāṃ napāt savitā tasyaveda |
Translation: 2 Well knoweth Savitar, O Child of Waters, where ocean, firmly fixt, o’erflowed its limit.

Sanskit Text: अतो भूरत आ उत्थितं रजो.अतो दयावाप्र्थिवीप्रथेताम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ato bhūrata ā utthitaṃ rajo.ato dyāvāpṛthivīaprathetām ||
Translation: Thence sprang the world, from that uprose the region: thence heaven spread out and the wide earth expanded.

Sanskit Text: पश्चेदमन्यदभवद यजत्रममर्त्यस्य भुवनस्य भूना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: paścedamanyadabhavad yajatramamartyasya bhuvanasya bhūnā |
Translation: 3 Then, with a full crowd of Immortal Beings, this other realm came later, high and holy.

Sanskit Text: सुपर्णो अङग सवितुर्गरुत्मान पूर्वो जातः स उ अस्यानुधर्म ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: suparṇo aṅgha saviturgharutmān pūrvo jātaḥ sa u asyānudharma ||
Translation: First, verily, Savitar's strong-pinioned Eagle was born: and he obeys his law for ever.

Sanskit Text: गाव इव गरामं यूयुधिरिवाश्वान वाश्रेव वत्संसुमना दुहाना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghāva iva ghrāmaṃ yūyudhirivāśvān vāśreva vatsaṃsumanā duhānā |
Translation: 4 As warriors to their steeds, kine to their village, as fond milk giving cows approach their youngling,

Sanskit Text: पतिरिव जायामभि नो नयेतु धर्तादिवः सविता विश्ववारः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: patiriva jāyāmabhi no nyetu dhartādivaḥ savitā viśvavāraḥ ||
Translation: As man to wife, let Savitar come downward to us, heaven's bearer, Lord of every blessing.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्यस्तूपः सवितर्यथा तवाङगिरसो जुह्वे वाजे अस्मिन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyastūpaḥ savitaryathā tvāṅghiraso juhve vāje asmin |
Translation: 5 Like the Aṅgirasa Hiranvastupa, I call thee, Savitar, to this achievement:

Sanskit Text: एवा तवार्चन्नवसे वन्दमानः सोमस्येवाण्शुं परतिजागराहम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evā tvārcannavase vandamānaḥ somasyevāṇśuṃ pratijāgharāham ||
Translation: So worshipping and lauding thee for favour I watch for thee as for the stalk of Soma.

Sanskit Text: समिद्धश्चित समिध्यसे देवेभ्यो हव्यवाहन |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samiddhaścit samidhyase devebhyo havyavāhana |
Translation: 1. THOU, bearer of oblations, though kindled, art kindled for the Gods.

Sanskit Text: आदित्यैरुद्रैर्वसुभिर्न आ गहि मर्ळीकाय न आ गहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityairudrairvasubhirna ā ghahi mṛḷīkāya na ā ghahi ||
Translation: With the Ādityas, Rudras, Vasus, come to us: to show us favour come to us.

Sanskit Text: इमं यज्ञमिदं वचो जुजुषाण उपागहि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ yajñamidaṃ vaco jujuṣāṇa upāghahi |
Translation: 2 Come hither and accept with joy this sacrifice and hymn of ours.

Sanskit Text: मर्तासस्त्वासमिधान हवामहे मर्ळीकाय हवामहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: martāsastvāsamidhāna havāmahe mṛḷīkāya havāmahe ||
Translation: O kindled God, we mortals are invoking thee, calling on thee to show us grace.

Sanskit Text: तवामु जातवेदसं विश्ववारं गर्णे धिया |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvāmu jātavedasaṃ viśvavāraṃ ghṛṇe dhiyā |
Translation: 3 I laud thee Jātavedas, thee Lord of all blessings, with my song.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने देवाना वह नः परियव्रतान मर्ळीकाय परियव्रतान ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne devānā vaha naḥ priyavratān mṛḷīkāya priyavratān ||
Translation: Agni, bring hitherward the Gods whose Laws we love, whose laws we love, to show us grace.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्देवो देवानामभवत पुरोहितो.अग्निं मनुष्या रषयःसमीधिरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirdevo devānāmabhavat purohito.aghniṃ manuṣyā ṛṣayaḥsamīdhire |
Translation: 4 Agni the God was made the great High-Priest of Gods, Ṛṣis have kindled Agni, men of mortal mould.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं महो धनसातावहं हुवे मर्ळीकन्धनसातये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ maho dhanasātāvahaṃ huve mṛḷīkandhanasātaye ||
Translation: Agni I invocate for winning ample wealth. kindly disposed for winning wealth.

Sanskit Text: अग्निरत्रिं भरद्वाजं गविष्ठिरं परावन नः कण्वन्त्रसदस्युमाहवे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniratriṃ bharadvājaṃ ghaviṣṭhiraṃ prāvan naḥ kaṇvantrasadasyumāhave |
Translation: 5 Atri and Bharadvāja and Gavisthira, Kaṇva and Trasadasyu, in our fight he helped.

Sanskit Text: अग्निं वसिष्ठो हवते पुरोहितोम्र्ळीकाय पुरोहितः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ vasiṣṭho havate purohitomṛḷīkāya purohitaḥ ||
Translation: On Agni calls Vasiṣṭha, even the household priest, the household priest to win his grace.

Sanskit Text: शरद्धयाग्निः समिध्यते शरद्धय हुयते हविः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śraddhayāghniḥ samidhyate śraddhaya huyate haviḥ |
Translation: 1. By Faith is Agni kindled, through Faith is oblation offered up.

Sanskit Text: शरद्धां भगस्य मूर्धनि वचसा वेदयमसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śraddhāṃ bhaghasya mūrdhani vacasā vedayamasi ||
Translation: We celebrate with praises Faith upon the height of happiness.

Sanskit Text: परियं शरद्धे ददतः परियं शरद्द्ते दिदासतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyaṃ śraddhe dadataḥ priyaṃ śraddte didāsataḥ |
Translation: 2 Bless thou the man who gives, O Faith; Faith, bless the man who fain would give.

Sanskit Text: परियम्भोजेषु यज्वस्विदं म उदितं कर्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: priyambhojeṣu yajvasvidaṃ ma uditaṃ kṛdhi ||
Translation: Bless thou the liberal worshippers: bless thou the word that I have said.

Sanskit Text: यथा देव असुरेषु शरद्धामुग्रेषु चक्रिरे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathā deva asureṣu śraddhāmughreṣu cakrire |
Translation: 3 Even as the Deities maintained Faith in the mighty Asuras,

Sanskit Text: एवम्भोजेषु यज्वस्वस्माकमुदितं कर्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: evambhojeṣu yajvasvasmākamuditaṃ kṛdhi ||
Translation: So make this uttered wish of mine true for the liberal worshippers.

Sanskit Text: शरद्धां देवा यजमाना वायुगोपा उपासते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śraddhāṃ devā yajamānā vāyughopā upāsate |
Translation: 4 Guarded by Vāyu, Gods and men who sacrifice draw near to Faith.

Sanskit Text: शरद्धांह्र्दय्ययाकूत्या शरद्धया विन्दते वसु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śraddhāṃhṛdayyayākūtyā śraddhayā vindate vasu ||
Translation: Man winneth Faith by yearnings of the heart, and opulence by Faith.

Sanskit Text: शरद्धां परातै हवामहे शरद्धां मध्यन्दिनं परि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śraddhāṃ prātai havāmahe śraddhāṃ madhyandinaṃ pari |
Translation: 5 Faith in the early morning, Faith at noonday will we invocate,

Sanskit Text: शरद्धां सूर्यस्य निम्रुचि शरद्धे शरद धापयेह नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śraddhāṃ sūryasya nimruci śraddhe śrad dhāpayeha naḥ ||
Translation: Faith at the setting of the Sun. O Faith, endow us with belief.

Sanskit Text: शास इत्था महानस्यमित्रखादो अद्भुतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śāsa itthā mahānasyamitrakhādo adbhutaḥ |
Translation: 1. A MIGHTY Governor art thou, Wondrous, Destroyer of the foe,

Sanskit Text: न यस्यहन्यते सखा न जीयते कदा चन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na yasyahanyate sakhā na jīyate kadā cana ||
Translation: Whose friend is never done to death, and never, never overcome.

Sanskit Text: सवस्तिद विशस पतिर्व्र्त्रहा विम्र्धो वशी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svastida viśas patirvṛtrahā vimṛdho vaśī |
Translation: 2 Lord of the clan, who brings us bliss, Strong, Warrior, Slayer of the fiend,

Sanskit Text: वर्षेन्द्रःपुर एतु नः सोमप अभयंकरः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣendraḥpura etu naḥ somapa abhayaṃkaraḥ ||
Translation: May India, Soma-drinker, go before us, Bull who gives us peace.

Sanskit Text: वि रक्षो वि मर्धो जहि वि वर्त्रस्य हनू रुज |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi rakṣo vi mṛdho jahi vi vṛtrasya hanū ruja |
Translation: 3 Drive Rākṣasas and foes away, break thou in pieces Vṛtra'sjaws:

Sanskit Text: वि मन्युमिन्द्र वर्त्रहन्नमित्रस्याभिदसतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi manyumindra vṛtrahannamitrasyābhidasataḥ ||
Translation: O Vṛtra-slaying Indra, quell the foeman's wrath who threatens us.

Sanskit Text: वि न इन्द्र मर्धो जहि नीचा यछ पर्तन्यतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi na indra mṛdho jahi nīcā yacha pṛtanyataḥ |
Translation: 4 O Indra, beat our foes away, humble the men who challenge us:

Sanskit Text: यो अस्मानभिदासत्यधरं गमया तमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo asmānabhidāsatyadharaṃ ghamayā tamaḥ ||
Translation: Send down to nether darkness him who seeks to do us injury.

Sanskit Text: अपेन्द्र दविषतो मनो.अप जिज्यासतो वधम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apendra dviṣato mano.apa jijyāsato vadham |
Translation: 5 Baffle the foeman's plan, ward off his weapon who would conquer us.

Sanskit Text: वि मन्योःशर्म यछ वरीयो यवया वधम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi manyoḥśarma yacha varīyo yavayā vadham ||
Translation: Give shelter from his furious wrath, and keep his murdering dart afar.

Sanskit Text: ईङखयन्तीरपस्युव इन्द्रं जातमुपासते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: īṅkhayantīrapasyuva indraṃ jātamupāsate |
Translation: 1. SWAYING about, the Active Ones came nigh to Indra at his birth,

Sanskit Text: भेजानसःसुवीर्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhejānasaḥsuvīryam ||
Translation: And shared his great heroic might.

Sanskit Text: तवमिन्द्र बलादधि सहसो जात ओजसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamindra balādadhi sahaso jāta ojasaḥ |
Translation: 2 Based upon strength and victory and power, O Indra is thy birth:

Sanskit Text: तवं वर्षन्व्र्षेदसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ vṛṣanvṛṣedasi ||
Translation: Thou, Mighty One, art strong indeed.

Sanskit Text: तवमिन्द्रासि वर्त्रहा वयन्तरिक्षमतिरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamindrāsi vṛtrahā vyantarikṣamatiraḥ |
Translation: 3 Thou art the Vṛtra-slayer, thou, Indra, hast spread the firmament:

Sanskit Text: उद दयामस्तभ्ना ओजसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ud dyāmastabhnā ojasā ||
Translation: Thou hast with might upheld the heavens.

Sanskit Text: तवमिन्द्र सजोषसमर्कं बिभर्षि बाह्वोः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamindra sajoṣasamarkaṃ bibharṣi bāhvoḥ |
Translation: 4 Thou, Indra, bearest in thine arms the lightning that accords with thee,

Sanskit Text: वज्रंशिशान ओजसा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vajraṃśiśāna ojasā ||
Translation: Whetting thy thunderbolt with might.

Sanskit Text: तवमिन्द्राभिभूरसि विश्वा जातान्योजसा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvamindrābhibhūrasi viśvā jātānyojasā |
Translation: 5 Thou, Indra, art preeminent over all creatures in thy might:

Sanskit Text: स विश्वाभुव आभवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa viśvābhuva ābhavaḥ ||
Translation: Thou hast pervaded every place.

Sanskit Text: सोम एकेभ्यः पवते घर्तमेक उपासते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: soma ekebhyaḥ pavate ghṛtameka upāsate |
Translation: 1. FOR some is Soma purified, some sit by sacrificial oil:

Sanskit Text: येभ्यो मधुप्रधावति तांश्चिदेवापि गछतात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yebhyo madhupradhāvati tāṃścidevāpi ghachatāt ||
Translation: To those for whom the meath flows forth, even to those let him depart.

Sanskit Text: तपसा ये अनाध्र्ष्यास्तपसा ये सवर्ययुः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tapasā ye anādhṛṣyāstapasā ye svaryayuḥ |
Translation: 2 Invincible through Fervour, those whom Fervour hath advanced to heaven,

Sanskit Text: तपो येचक्रिरे महस्तांश्चिदेवापि गछतात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tapo yecakrire mahastāṃścidevāpi ghachatāt ||
Translation: Who showed great Fervour in their lives, -even to those let him depart.

Sanskit Text: ये युध्यन्ते परधनेषु शूरासो ये तनूत्यजः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye yudhyante pradhaneṣu śūrāso ye tanūtyajaḥ |
Translation: 3 The heroes who contend in war and boldly cast their lives away,

Sanskit Text: ये वासहस्रदक्षिणास्तांश्चिदेवापि गछतात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye vāsahasradakṣiṇāstāṃścidevāpi ghachatāt ||
Translation: Or who give guerdon thousandfold, -even to those let him depart.

Sanskit Text: ये चित पूर्व रतसाप रतावान रताव्र्धः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ye cit pūrva ṛtasāpa ṛtāvāna ṛtāvṛdhaḥ |
Translation: 4 Yea, the first followers of Law, Law's pure and holy strengtheners,

Sanskit Text: पितॄन तपस्वतोयम तांश्चिदेवापि गछतात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pitṝn tapasvatoyama tāṃścidevāpi ghachatāt ||
Translation: The Fathers, Yama! Fervour-moved,even to those let him depart.

Sanskit Text: सहस्रणीथाः कवयो ये गोपायन्ति सूर्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasraṇīthāḥ kavayo ye ghopāyanti sūryam |
Translation: 5 Skilled in a thousand ways and means, the sages who protect the Sun,

Sanskit Text: रषीन्तपस्वतो यम तपोजानपि गछतात ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛṣīntapasvato yama tapojānapi ghachatāt ||
Translation: The Ṛṣis, Yama! Fervour-moved,—even to those let him depart.

Sanskit Text: अरायि काणे विकटे गिरिं गछ सदान्वे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: arāyi kāṇe vikaṭe ghiriṃ ghacha sadānve |
Translation: 1. ARAYI, one-eyed limping hag, fly, ever-screeching, to the hill.

Sanskit Text: शिरिम्बिठस्यसत्वभिस्तेभिष टवा चातयामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śirimbiṭhasyasatvabhistebhiṣ ṭvā cātayāmasi ||
Translation: We frighten thee away with these, the heroes of Sirimbitha.

Sanskit Text: चत्तो इतश्चत्तामुतः सर्वा भरूणान्यारुषी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: catto itaścattāmutaḥ sarvā bhrūṇānyāruṣī |
Translation: 2 Scared from this place and that is she, destroyer of each germ unborn.

Sanskit Text: अराय्यं बरह्मणस पते तीक्ष्णश्र्ण्गोद्र्षन्निहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: arāyyaṃ brahmaṇas pate tīkṣṇaśṛṇghodṛṣannihi ||
Translation: Go, sharp-horned Brāhmaṇaspti and drive Arayi far away.

Sanskit Text: अदो यद दारु पलवते सिन्धोः पारे अपूरुषम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ado yad dāru plavate sindhoḥ pāre apūruṣam |
Translation: 3 Yon log that floats without a man to guide it on the river's edge,—

Sanskit Text: तदारभस्व दुर्हणो तेन गछ परस्तरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tadārabhasva durhaṇo tena ghacha parastaram ||
Translation: Seize it, thou thing with hideous jaws, and go thou far away thereon.

Sanskit Text: यद ध पराचीरजगन्तोरो मण्डूरधाणिकीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yad dha prācīrajaghantoro maṇḍūradhāṇikīḥ |
Translation: 4 When, foul with secret stain and spot, ye hastened onward to the breast,

Sanskit Text: हतािन्द्रस्य शत्रवः सर्वे बुद्बुदयाशवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hatāindrasya śatravaḥ sarve budbudayāśavaḥ ||
Translation: All Indra's enemies were slain and passed away like froth and foam.

Sanskit Text: परीमे गामनेषत पर्यग्निमह्र्षत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: parīme ghāmaneṣata paryaghnimahṛṣata |
Translation: 5 These men have led about the cow, have duly carried Agni round,

Sanskit Text: देवेष्वक्रतश्रवः क इमाना दधर्षति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: deveṣvakrataśravaḥ ka imānā dadharṣati ||
Translation: And raised their glory tg the Gods. Who will attack them with success?

Sanskit Text: अग्निं हिन्वन्तु नो धियः सप्तिमाशुमिवाजिषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṃ hinvantu no dhiyaḥ saptimāśumivājiṣu |
Translation: 1. LET songs of ours speed Agni forth like a fleet courser in the race,

Sanskit Text: तेन जेष्मधनं-धनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tena jeṣmadhanaṃ-dhanam ||
Translation: And we will win each prize through him.

Sanskit Text: यया गा आकरामहे सेनयाग्ने तवोत्या |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yayā ghā ākarāmahe senayāghne tavotyā |
Translation: 2 Agni the dart whereby we gain kine for ourselves with help from thee,—

Sanskit Text: तां नो हिन्वमघत्तये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāṃ no hinvamaghattaye ||
Translation: That send us for the gain of wealth.

Sanskit Text: आग्ने सथूरं रयिं भर पर्थुं गोमन्तमश्विनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āghne sthūraṃ rayiṃ bhara pṛthuṃ ghomantamaśvinam |
Translation: 3 O Agni, bring us wealth secure, vast wealth in horses and in kine:

Sanskit Text: अंधिखं वर्तया पणिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṃdhikhaṃ vartayā paṇim ||
Translation: Oil thou the socket, turn the wheel.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने नक्षत्रमजरमा सूर्यं रोहयो दिवि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne nakṣatramajaramā sūryaṃ rohayo divi |
Translation: 4 O Agni, thou hast made the Sun, Eternal Star, to mount the sky,

Sanskit Text: दधज्ज्योतिर्जनेभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dadhajjyotirjanebhyaḥ ||
Translation: Bestowing light on living men.

Sanskit Text: अग्ने केतुर्विशामसि परेष्ठः शरेष्ठ उपस्थसत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghne keturviśāmasi preṣṭhaḥ śreṣṭha upasthasat |
Translation: 5 Thou, Agni, art the people's light, best, dearest, seated in thy shrine:

Sanskit Text: बोधा सतोत्रे वयो दधत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bodhā stotre vayo dadhat ||
Translation: Watch for the singer, give him life.

Sanskit Text: इमा नु कं भुवना सीषधामेन्द्रश्च विश्वे च देवाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imā nu kaṃ bhuvanā sīṣadhāmendraśca viśve ca devāḥ ||
Translation: 1. WE will, with Indra and all Gods to aid us, bring these existing worlds into subjection.

Sanskit Text: यज्ञं च नस्तन्वं च परजां चादित्यैरिन्द्रः सहचीक्ळिपाति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajñaṃ ca nastanvaṃ ca prajāṃ cādityairindraḥ sahacīkḷipāti ||
Translation: 2 Our sacrifice, our bodies, and our offspr. let Indra form together with Ādityas.

Sanskit Text: आदित्यैरिन्द्रः सगणो मरुद्भिरस्माकं भूत्ववितातनूनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ādityairindraḥ saghaṇo marudbhirasmākaṃ bhūtvavitātanūnām ||
Translation: 3 With the Ādityas, with the band of Maruts, may Indra be Protector of our bodies.

Sanskit Text: हत्वाय देवा असुरान यदायन देवा देवत्वमभिरक्षमाणाः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: hatvāya devā asurān yadāyan devā devatvamabhirakṣamāṇāḥ ||
Translation: 4 As when the Gods came, after they had slaughtered the Asuras, keeping safe their Godlike nature,

Sanskit Text: परत्यञ्चमर्कमनयञ्छचीभिरादित सवधामिषिराम्पर्यपश्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pratyañcamarkamanayañchacībhirādit svadhāmiṣirāmparyapaśyan ||
Translation: 5 Brought the Sun hitherward with mighty powers, and looked about them on their vigorous Godhead.

Sanskit Text: सूर्यो नो दिवस पातु वातो अन्तरिक्षात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūryo no divas pātu vāto antarikṣāt |
Translation: 1. MAY Sūrya guard us out of heaven, and Vāta from the firmament,

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्नःपार्थिवेभ्यः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirnaḥpārthivebhyaḥ ||
Translation: And Agni from terrestrial spots.

Sanskit Text: जोषा सवितर्यस्य ते हरः शतं सवानर्हति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: joṣā savitaryasya te haraḥ śataṃ savānarhati |
Translation: 2 Thou Savitar whose flame deserves hundred libations, be thou pleased:

Sanskit Text: पाहिनो दिद्युतः पतन्त्याः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pāhino didyutaḥ patantyāḥ ||
Translation: From failing lightning keep us safe.

Sanskit Text: चक्षुर्नो देवः सविता चक्षुर्न उत पर्वतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakṣurno devaḥ savitā cakṣurna uta parvataḥ |
Translation: 3 May Savitar the God, and may Parvata also give us sight;

Sanskit Text: चक्षुर्धाता दधातु नः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakṣurdhātā dadhātu naḥ ||
Translation: May the Creator give us sight.

Sanskit Text: चक्षुर्नो धेहि चक्षुषे चक्षुर्विख्यै तनूभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: cakṣurno dhehi cakṣuṣe cakṣurvikhyai tanūbhyaḥ |
Translation: 4 Give sight unto our eye, give thou our bodies sight that they may see:

Sanskit Text: संचेदं वि च पश्येम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃcedaṃ vi ca paśyema ||
Translation: May we survey, discern this world.

Sanskit Text: सुसन्द्र्शं तवा वयं परति पश्येम सूर्य |
Sanskrit Transliteration: susandṛśaṃ tvā vayaṃ prati paśyema sūrya |
Translation: 5 Thus, Sūrya, may we look on thee, on thee most lovely to behold,

Sanskit Text: वि पश्येमन्र्चक्षसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vi paśyemanṛcakṣasaḥ ||
Translation: See clearly with the eyes of men.

Sanskit Text: उदसौ सूर्यो अगादुदयं मामको भगः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: udasau sūryo aghādudayaṃ māmako bhaghaḥ |
Translation: 1. YON Sun hath mounted up, and this my happy fate hate mounted high.

Sanskit Text: अहं तद्विद्वला पतिमभ्यसाक्षि विषासहिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ tadvidvalā patimabhyasākṣi viṣāsahiḥ ||
Translation: I knowing this, as conqueror have won my husband for mine own.

Sanskit Text: अहं केतुरहं मूर्धाहमुग्रा विवाचनी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahaṃ keturahaṃ mūrdhāhamughrā vivācanī |
Translation: 2 I am the banner and the head, a mighty arbitress am I:

Sanskit Text: ममेदनुक्रतुं पतिः सेहानाया उपाचरेत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mamedanukratuṃ patiḥ sehānāyā upācaret ||
Translation: I am victorious, and my Lord shall be submissive to my will.

Sanskit Text: मम पुत्राः शत्रुहणो.अथो मे दुहिता विराट |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mama putrāḥ śatruhaṇo.atho me duhitā virāṭ |
Translation: 3 My Sons are slayers of the foe, my Daughter is a ruling Queen:

Sanskit Text: उताहमस्मि संजया पत्यौ मे शलोक उत्तमः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: utāhamasmi saṃjayā patyau me śloka uttamaḥ ||
Translation: I am victorious: o’er my Lord my song of triumph is supreme.

Sanskit Text: येनेन्द्रो हविषा कर्त्व्यभवद दयुम्न्युत्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenendro haviṣā kṛtvyabhavad dyumnyuttamaḥ |
Translation: 4 Oblation, that which Indra gave and thus grew glorious and most high,—

Sanskit Text: इदं तदक्रि देवा असपत्ना किलाभुवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ tadakri devā asapatnā kilābhuvam ||
Translation: This have I offered, O ye Gods, and rid me of each rival wife.

Sanskit Text: असपत्ना सपत्नघ्नी जयन्त्यभिभूवरी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asapatnā sapatnaghnī jayantyabhibhūvarī |
Translation: 5 Destroyer of the rival wife, Sole Spouse, victorious, conqueror,

Sanskit Text: आव्र्क्षमन्यासां वर्चो राधो अस्थेयसामिव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āvṛkṣamanyāsāṃ varco rādho astheyasāmiva ||
Translation: The others' glory have I seized as ’twere the wealth of weaker Dames.

Sanskit Text: समजैषमिमा अहं सपत्नीरभिभूवरी |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samajaiṣamimā ahaṃ sapatnīrabhibhūvarī |
Translation: 6 I have subdued as conqueror these rivals, these my fellow-wives,

Sanskit Text: यथाहमस्य वीरस्य विराजानि जनस्य च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathāhamasya vīrasya virājāni janasya ca ||
Translation: That I may hold imperial sway over this Hero and the folk.

Sanskit Text: तीव्रस्याभिवयसो अस्य पाहि सर्वरथा वि हरी इह मुञ्च |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tīvrasyābhivayaso asya pāhi sarvarathā vi harī iha muñca |
Translation: 1. TASTE this strong draught enriched with offered viands: with all thy chariot here unyoke thy Coursers.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र मा तवा यजमानासो अन्ये नि रीरमन तुभ्यमिमेसुतासः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra mā tvā yajamānāso anye ni rīraman tubhyamimesutāsaḥ ||
Translation: Let not those other sacrificers stay thee, Indra: these juices shed for thee are ready.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्यं सुतास्तुभ्यमु सोत्वासस्त्वां गिरः शवात्र्याा हवयन्ति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyaṃ sutāstubhyamu sotvāsastvāṃ ghiraḥ śvātryāā hvayanti |
Translation: 2 Thine is the juice effused, thine are the juices yet to be pressed: our resonant songs invite thee.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रेदमद्य सवनं जुषाणो विश्वस्यविद्वानिह पाहि सोमम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indredamadya savanaṃ juṣāṇo viśvasyavidvāniha pāhi somam ||
Translation: O Indra, pleased to-day with this libation, come, thou who knowest all and drink the Soma.

Sanskit Text: य उशता मनसा सोममस्मै सर्वह्र्दा देवकामः सुनोति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ya uśatā manasā somamasmai sarvahṛdā devakāmaḥ sunoti |
Translation: 3 Whoso, devoted to the God, effuses Soma for him with yearning heart and spirit,—

Sanskit Text: न गा इन्द्रस्तस्य परा ददाति परशस्तमिच्चारुमस्मैक्र्णोति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: na ghā indrastasya parā dadāti praśastamiccārumasmaikṛṇoti ||
Translation: Never doth Indra give away his cattle: for him he makes the lovely Soma famous.

Sanskit Text: अनुस्पष्टो भवत्येषो अस्य यो अस्मै रेवान न सुनोति सोमम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: anuspaṣṭo bhavatyeṣo asya yo asmai revān na sunoti somam |
Translation: 4 He looks with Ioving favour on the mortal who, like a rich man, pours for him the Soma.

Sanskit Text: निररत्नौ मघवा तं दधाति बरह्मद्विषो हन्त्यनानुदिष्टः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: niraratnau maghavā taṃ dadhāti brahmadviṣo hantyanānudiṣṭaḥ ||
Translation: Maghavan in his bended arm supports him: he slays, unasked, the men who hate devotion.

Sanskit Text: अश्वायन्तो गव्यन्तो वाजयन्तो हवामहे तवोपगन्तवा उ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśvāyanto ghavyanto vājayanto havāmahe tvopaghantavā u |
Translation: 5 We call on thee to come to us, desirous of goods and spoil, of cattle, and of horses.

Sanskit Text: आभूषन्तस्ते सुमतौ नवायां वयमिन्द्र तवा शुनंहुवेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ābhūṣantaste sumatau navāyāṃ vayamindra tvā śunaṃhuvema ||
Translation: For thy new love and favour are we present: let us invoke thee, Indra, as our welfare.

Sanskit Text: मुञ्चामि तवा हविषा जीवनाय कमज्ञातयक्ष्मादुतराजयक्ष्मात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: muñcāmi tvā haviṣā jīvanāya kamajñātayakṣmādutarājayakṣmāt |
Translation: 1. FOR life I set thee free by this oblation from the unknown decline and from Consumption;

Sanskit Text: गराहिर्जग्राह यदि वैतदेनं तस्यािन्द्राग्नी पर मुमुक्तमेनम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghrāhirjaghrāha yadi vaitadenaṃ tasyāindrāghnī pra mumuktamenam ||
Translation: Or, if the grasping demon have possessed him, free him from her, O Indra, thou and Agni.

Sanskit Text: यदि कषितायुर्यदि वा परेतो यदि मर्त्योरन्तिकं नीतेव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadi kṣitāyuryadi vā pareto yadi mṛtyorantikaṃ nītaeva |
Translation: 2 Be his days ended, be he now departed, be he brought very near to death already,

Sanskit Text: तमा हरामि निरतेरुपस्थादस्पार्षमेनंशतशारदाय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tamā harāmi nirterupasthādaspārṣamenaṃśataśāradāya ||
Translation: Out of Destruction's lap again I bring him, save him for life to last a hundred autumns.

Sanskit Text: सहस्राक्षेण शतशारदेन शतायुषा हविषाहार्षमेनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasrākṣeṇa śataśāradena śatāyuṣā haviṣāhārṣamenam |
Translation: 3 With hundred-eyed oblation, hundred-autumned, bringing a hundred lives, have I restored him,

Sanskit Text: शतं यथेमं शरदो नयातीन्द्रो विश्वस्यदुरितस्य पारम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ yathemaṃ śarado nayātīndro viśvasyaduritasya pāram ||
Translation: That Indra for a hundred years may lead him safe to the farther shore of all misfortune.

Sanskit Text: शतं जीव शरदो वर्धमानः शतं हेमन्ताञ्छतमुवसन्तान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śataṃ jīva śarado vardhamānaḥ śataṃ hemantāñchatamuvasantān |
Translation: 4 Live, waxing in thy strength, a hundred autumns, live through a hundred springs, a hundred winters.

Sanskit Text: शतमिन्द्राग्नी सविता बर्हस्पतिः शतायुषाहविषेमं पुनर्दुः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śatamindrāghnī savitā bṛhaspatiḥ śatāyuṣāhaviṣemaṃ punarduḥ ||
Translation: Through hundred-lived oblation Indra, Agni, Bṛhaspati, Savitar yield him for a hundred!

Sanskit Text: आहार्षं तवाविदं तवा पुनरागाः पुनर्नव |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āhārṣaṃ tvāvidaṃ tvā punarāghāḥ punarnava |
Translation: 5 So have I found and rescued thee thou hast returned with youth renewed.

Sanskit Text: सर्वाङगसर्वं ते चक्षुः सर्वमायुश्च ते.अविदम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sarvāṅghasarvaṃ te cakṣuḥ sarvamāyuśca te.avidam ||
Translation: Whole in thy members! I have found thy sight and all thy life for thee.

Sanskit Text: बरह्मणाग्निः संविदानो रक्षोहा बाधतामितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: brahmaṇāghniḥ saṃvidāno rakṣohā bādhatāmitaḥ |
Translation: 1. MAY Agni, yielding to our prayer, the Rakṣas-slayer, drive away

Sanskit Text: अमीवायस्ते गर्भं दुर्णामा योनिमाशये ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: amīvāyaste gharbhaṃ durṇāmā yonimāśaye ||
Translation: The malady of evil name that hath beset thy labouring womb.

Sanskit Text: यस्ते गर्भममीवा दुर्णामा योनिमाशये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaste gharbhamamīvā durṇāmā yonimāśaye |
Translation: 2 Agni, concurring in the prayer, drive off the eater of the flesh,

Sanskit Text: अग्निष टम्ब्रह्मणा सह निष करव्यादमनीनशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghniṣ ṭambrahmaṇā saha niṣ kravyādamanīnaśat ||
Translation: The malady of evil name that hath attacked thy babe and womb.

Sanskit Text: यस्ते हन्ति पतयन्तं निषत्स्नुं यः सरीस्र्पम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaste hanti patayantaṃ niṣatsnuṃ yaḥ sarīsṛpam |
Translation: 3 That which destroys the sinking germ, the settled, moving embryo,

Sanskit Text: जातंयस्ते जिघांसति तमितो नाशयामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jātaṃyaste jighāṃsati tamito nāśayāmasi ||
Translation: That which will kill the babe at birth,—even this will we drive far away.

Sanskit Text: यस्त ऊरू विहरत्यन्तरा दम्पती शये |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasta ūrū viharatyantarā dampatī śaye |
Translation: 4 That which divides thy legs that it may lie between the married pair,

Sanskit Text: योनिं योन्तरारेळि तमितो नाशयामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yoniṃ yoantarāreḷi tamito nāśayāmasi ||
Translation: That penetrates and licks thy side,—even this will we exterminate.

Sanskit Text: यस्त्वा भराता पतिर्भूत्वा जारो भूत्वा निपद्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yastvā bhrātā patirbhūtvā jāro bhūtvā nipadyate |
Translation: 5 What rests by thee in borrowed form of brother, lover, or of lord,

Sanskit Text: परजां यस्ते जिघांसति तमितो नाशयामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prajāṃ yaste jighāṃsati tamito nāśayāmasi ||
Translation: And would destroy thy Progeny,—even this will we exterminate.

Sanskit Text: यस्त्वा सवप्नेन तमसा मोहयित्वा निपद्यते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yastvā svapnena tamasā mohayitvā nipadyate |
Translation: 6 That which through sleep or darkness hath deceived thee and lies down by thee,

Sanskit Text: परजां यस्ते जिघांसति तमितो नाशयामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prajāṃ yaste jighāṃsati tamito nāśayāmasi ||
Translation: And will destroy thy progeny,—even this will we exterminate.

Sanskit Text: अक्षीभ्यां ते नासिकाभ्यां कर्णाभ्यां छुबुकादधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: akṣībhyāṃ te nāsikābhyāṃ karṇābhyāṃ chubukādadhi |
Translation: 1. FROM both thy nostrils, from thine eyes, from both thine ears and from thy chin,

Sanskit Text: यक्ष्मं शीर्षण्यं मस्तिष्काज्जिह्वाया वि वर्हामि ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yakṣmaṃ śīrṣaṇyaṃ mastiṣkājjihvāyā vi vṛhāmi te ||
Translation: Forth from thy head and brain and tongue I drive thy malady away.

Sanskit Text: गरीवाभ्यस्त उष्णिहाभ्यः कीकसाभ्यो अनूक्यात |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghrīvābhyasta uṣṇihābhyaḥ kīkasābhyo anūkyāt |
Translation: 2 From the neck-tendons and the neck, from the breast-bones and from the spine,

Sanskit Text: यक्ष्मं दोषण्यमंसाभ्यां बाहुभ्यां वि वर्हामि ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yakṣmaṃ doṣaṇyamaṃsābhyāṃ bāhubhyāṃ vi vṛhāmi te ||
Translation: From shoulders, upper, lower arms, I drive thy malady away.

Sanskit Text: आन्त्रेभ्यस्ते गुदाभ्यो वनिष्ठोर्ह्र्दयादधि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āntrebhyaste ghudābhyo vaniṣṭhorhṛdayādadhi |
Translation: 3 From viscera and all within, forth from the rectum, from the heart,

Sanskit Text: यक्ष्मम्मतस्नाभ्यां यक्नः पलाशिभ्यो वि वर्हामि ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yakṣmammatasnābhyāṃ yaknaḥ plāśibhyo vi vṛhāmi te ||
Translation: From kidneys, liver, and from spleen, I drive thy malady away.

Sanskit Text: ऊरुभ्यां ते अष्ठीवद्भ्यां पार्ष्णिभ्यां परपदाभ्याम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ūrubhyāṃ te aṣṭhīvadbhyāṃ pārṣṇibhyāṃ prapadābhyām |
Translation: 4 From thighs, from knee-caps, and from heels, and from the forepart of the feet,

Sanskit Text: यक्ष्मं शरोणिभ्यां भासदाद भंससो वि वर्हामि ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yakṣmaṃ śroṇibhyāṃ bhāsadād bhaṃsaso vi vṛhāmi te ||
Translation: From hips from stomach, and from groin I drive thy malady away.

Sanskit Text: मेहनाद वनंकरणाल लोमभ्यस्ते नखेभ्यः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mehanād vanaṃkaraṇāl lomabhyaste nakhebhyaḥ |
Translation: 5 From what is voided from within, and from thy hair, and from they nails,

Sanskit Text: यक्ष्मंसर्वस्मादात्मनस्तमिदं वि वर्हामि ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yakṣmaṃsarvasmādātmanastamidaṃ vi vṛhāmi te ||
Translation: From all thyself from top to toe, I drive thy malady away.
