Sanskit Text: अङगाद-अङगाल लोम्नो-लोम्नो जातं पर्वणि-पर्वणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: aṅghād-aṅghāl lomno-lomno jātaṃ parvaṇi-parvaṇi |
Translation: 6 From every member, every hair, disease that comes in every joint,

Sanskit Text: यक्ष्मंसर्वस्मादात्मनस्तमिदं वि वर्हामि ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yakṣmaṃsarvasmādātmanastamidaṃ vi vṛhāmi te ||
Translation: From all thyself, from top to toe, I drive thy malady away.

Sanskit Text: अपेहि मनसस पते.अप कराम परश्चर |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apehi manasas pate.apa krāma paraścara |
Translation: 1. AVAUNT, thou Master of the mind Depart, and vanish far away.

Sanskit Text: परो निरतया आचक्ष्व बहुधा जीवतो मनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: paro nirtyā ācakṣva bahudhā jīvato manaḥ ||
Translation: Look on Destruction far from hence. The live man's mind is manifold.

Sanskit Text: भद्रं वै वरं वर्णते भद्रं युञ्जन्ति दक्षिणम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadraṃ vai varaṃ vṛṇate bhadraṃ yuñjanti dakṣiṇam |
Translation: 2 A happy boon do men elect, a mighty blessing they obtain.

Sanskit Text: भद्रं वैवस्वते चक्षुर्बहुत्रा जीवतो मनः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: bhadraṃ vaivasvate cakṣurbahutrā jīvato manaḥ ||
Translation: Bliss with Vaivasvata they see. The live man's mind seeks many a place.

Sanskit Text: यदाशसा निःशसाभिशसोपारिम जाग्रतो यत सवपन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadāśasā niḥśasābhiśasopārima jāghrato yat svapantaḥ |
Translation: 3 If by address, by blame, by imprecation we have committed sin, awake or sleeping,

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्विश्वान्यप दुष्क्र्तान्यजुष्टान्यारे अस्मद्दधातु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirviśvānyapa duṣkṛtānyajuṣṭānyāre asmaddadhātu ||
Translation: All hateful acts of ours, all evil doings may Agni bear away to distant places.

Sanskit Text: यदिन्द्र बरह्मणस पते.अभिद्रोहं चरामसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadindra brahmaṇas pate.abhidrohaṃ carāmasi |
Translation: 4 When, Indra, Brahmaṇaspati, our deeds are wrongful and unjust,

Sanskit Text: परचेता नाङगिरसो दविषतां पात्यंहसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pracetā naāṅghiraso dviṣatāṃ pātyaṃhasaḥ ||
Translation: May provident Aṅgirasa prevent our foes from troubling, us.

Sanskit Text: अजैष्माद्यासनाम चाभूमानागसो वयम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ajaiṣmādyāsanāma cābhūmānāghaso vayam |
Translation: 5 We have prevailed this day and won: we are made free from sin and guilt.

Sanskit Text: जाग्रत्स्वप्नःसंकल्पः पापो यं दविष्मस्तं स रछतु यो नो दवेष्टितं रछतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: jāghratsvapnaḥsaṃkalpaḥ pāpo yaṃ dviṣmastaṃ sa ṛchatu yo no dveṣṭitaṃ ṛchatu ||
Translation: Ill thoughts, that visit us awake or sleeping, seize the man we hate, yea, seize the man who hateth us.

Sanskit Text: देवाः कपोत इषितो यदिछन दूतो निरतया इदमाजगाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: devāḥ kapota iṣito yadichan dūto nirtyā idamājaghāma |
Translation: 1. GODS, whatsoe’er the Dove came hither seeking, sent to us as the envoy of Destruction,

Sanskit Text: तस्मा अर्चाम कर्णवाम निष्क्र्तिं शं नो अस्तु दविपदेशं चतुष्पदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmā arcāma kṛṇavāma niṣkṛtiṃ śaṃ no astu dvipadeśaṃ catuṣpade ||
Translation: For that let us sing hymns and make atonement. Well be it with our quadrupeds and bipeds.

Sanskit Text: शिवः कपोत इषितो नो अस्त्वनागा देवाः शकुनो गर्हेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śivaḥ kapota iṣito no astvanāghā devāḥ śakuno ghṛheṣu |
Translation: 2 Auspicious be the Dove that hath been sent us, a harmless bird, ye Gods, within our dwelling.

Sanskit Text: अग्निर्हि विप्रो जुषतां हविर्नः परि हेतिः पक्षिणी नोव्र्णक्तु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghnirhi vipro juṣatāṃ havirnaḥ pari hetiḥ pakṣiṇī novṛṇaktu ||
Translation: May Agni, Sage, be pleased with our oblation, and may the Missile borne on wings avoid us.

Sanskit Text: हेतिः पक्षिणी न दभात्यस्मानाष्ट्र्यां पदं कर्णुतेग्निधाने |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hetiḥ pakṣiṇī na dabhātyasmānāṣṭryāṃ padaṃ kṛṇuteaghnidhāne |
Translation: 3 Let not the Arrow that hath wings distract us: beside the fire-place, on the hearth it settles.

Sanskit Text: शं नो गोभ्यश्च पुरुषेभ्यश्चास्तु मा नोहिंसीदिह देवाः कपोतः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śaṃ no ghobhyaśca puruṣebhyaścāstu mā nohiṃsīdiha devāḥ kapotaḥ ||
Translation: May, it bring welfare to our men and cattle: here let the Dove, ye Gods, forbear to harm us.

Sanskit Text: यदुलूको वदति मोघमेतद यत कपोतः पदमग्नौक्र्णोति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadulūko vadati moghametad yat kapotaḥ padamaghnaukṛṇoti |
Translation: 4 The screeching of the owl is ineffective and when beside the fire the Dove hath settled,

Sanskit Text: यस्य दूतः परहित एष एतत तस्मै यमाय नमोस्तु मरित्यवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yasya dūtaḥ prahita eṣa etat tasmai yamāya namoastu mrityave ||
Translation: To him who sent it hither as an envoy, to him be reverence paid, to Death, to Yama.

Sanskit Text: रचा कपोतं नुदत परणोदमिषं मदन्तः परि गांनयध्वम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛcā kapotaṃ nudata praṇodamiṣaṃ madantaḥ pari ghāṃnayadhvam |
Translation: 5 Drive forth the Dove, chase it with holy verses: rejoicing, bring ye hither food and cattle,

Sanskit Text: संयोपयन्तो दुरितानि विश्वा हित्वा न ऊर्जं परपतात पतिष्थः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃyopayanto duritāni viśvā hitvā na ūrjaṃ prapatāt patiṣthaḥ ||
Translation: Barring the way against all grief and trouble. Let the swift bird fly forth and leave us vigour.

Sanskit Text: तुभ्येदमिन्द्र परि षिच्यते मधु तवं सुतस्य कलशस्यराजसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tubhyedamindra pari ṣicyate madhu tvaṃ sutasya kalaśasyarājasi |
Translation: 1. THIS pleasant meath, O Indra, is effused for thee: thou art the ruling Lord of beaker and of juice.

Sanskit Text: तवं रयिं पुरुवीरामु नस कर्धि तवं तपःपरितप्याजयः सवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ rayiṃ puruvīrāmu nas kṛdhi tvaṃ tapaḥparitapyājayaḥ svaḥ ||
Translation: Bestow upon us wealth with many hero sons: thou, having glowed with Fervour, wonnest heavenly light.

Sanskit Text: सवर्जितं महि मन्दानमन्धसो हवामहे परि शक्रंसुतानुप |
Sanskrit Transliteration: svarjitaṃ mahi mandānamandhaso havāmahe pari śakraṃsutānupa |
Translation: 2 Let us call Śakra to libations here effused, winner of light who joyeth in the potent juice.

Sanskit Text: इमं नो यज्ञमिह बोध्या गहि सप्र्धोजयन्तं मघवानमीमहे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: imaṃ no yajñamiha bodhyā ghahi spṛdhojayantaṃ maghavānamīmahe ||
Translation: Mark well this sacrifice of ours and come to us: we pray to Maghavan the Vanquisher of hosts.

Sanskit Text: सोमस्य राज्ञो वरुणस्य धर्मणि बर्हस्पतेरनुमत्या उशर्मणि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: somasya rājño varuṇasya dharmaṇi bṛhaspateranumatyā uśarmaṇi |
Translation: 3 By royal Soma's and by Varuṇa's decree, under Bṛhaspati's and Anumati's guard,

Sanskit Text: तवाहमद्य मघवन्नुपस्तुतौ धातर्विधातः कलशानभक्षयम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tavāhamadya maghavannupastutau dhātarvidhātaḥ kalaśānabhakṣayam ||
Translation: This day by thine authority, O Maghavan, Maker, Disposer thou! have I enjoyed the jars.

Sanskit Text: परसूतो भक्षमकरं चरावपि सतोमं चेमं परथमःसूरिरुन मर्जे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prasūto bhakṣamakaraṃ carāvapi stomaṃ cemaṃ prathamaḥsūrirun mṛje |
Translation: 4 1, too, urged on, have had my portion, in the bowl, and as first Prince I drew forth this my hymn of praise,

Sanskit Text: सुते सातेन यद्यागमं वां परतिविश्वामित्रजमदग्नी दमे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sute sātena yadyāghamaṃ vāṃ prativiśvāmitrajamadaghnī dame ||
Translation: When with the prize I came unto the flowing juice, O Viśvāmitra, Jamadagni, to your home.

Sanskit Text: वातस्य नु महिमानं रथस्य रुजन्नेति सतनयन्नस्यघोषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vātasya nu mahimānaṃ rathasya rujanneti stanayannasyaghoṣaḥ |
Translation: 1. O THE Wind's chariot, O its power and glory! Crashing it goes and hath a voice of thunder.

Sanskit Text: दिविस्प्र्ग यात्यरुणानि कर्ण्वन्नुतो एति पर्थिव्यारेणुमस्यन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divispṛgh yātyaruṇāni kṛṇvannuto eti pṛthivyāreṇumasyan ||
Translation: It makes the regions red and touches heaven, and as it moves the dust of earth is scattered.

Sanskit Text: सं परेरते अनु वातस्य विष्ठा ऐनं गछन्ति समनं नयोषाः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ prerate anu vātasy viṣṭhā ainaṃ ghachanti samanaṃ nayoṣāḥ |
Translation: 2 Along the traces of the Wind they hurry, they come to him as dames to an assembly.

Sanskit Text: ताभिः सयुक सरथं देव ईयते.अस्य विश्वस्यभुवनस्य राजा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tābhiḥ sayuk sarathaṃ deva īyate.asya viśvasyabhuvanasya rājā ||
Translation: Borne on his car with these for his attendants, the God speeds forth, the universe's Monarch.

Sanskit Text: अन्तरिक्षे पथिभिरीयमानो न नि विशते कतमच्चनाहः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: antarikṣe pathibhirīyamāno na ni viśate katamaccanāhaḥ |
Translation: 3 Travelling on the paths of air's mid-region, no single day doth he take rest or slumber.

Sanskit Text: अपां सखा परथमजा रतावा कव सविज्जातः कुत आबभूव ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apāṃ sakhā prathamajā ṛtāvā kva svijjātaḥ kuta ābabhūva ||
Translation: Holy and earliest-born, Friend of the waters, where did he spring and from what region came he?

Sanskit Text: आत्मा देवानां भुवनस्य गर्भो यथावशं चरति देवेषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ātmā devānāṃ bhuvanasya gharbho yathāvaśaṃ carati devaeṣaḥ |
Translation: 4 Germ of the world, the Deities’ vital spirit, this God moves ever as his will inclines him.

Sanskit Text: घोषा इदस्य शर्ण्विरे न रूपं तस्मै वातायहविषा विधेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghoṣā idasya śṛṇvire na rūpaṃ tasmai vātāyahaviṣā vidhema ||
Translation: His voice is heard, his shape is ever viewless. Let us adore this Wind with our oblation.

Sanskit Text: मयोभूर्वातो अभि वातूस्रा ऊर्जस्वतीरोषधीरारिशन्ताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mayobhūrvāto abhi vātūsrā ūrjasvatīroṣadhīrāriśantām |
Translation: 1. MAY the wind blow upon our Cows with healing: may they eat herbage full of vigorous juices.

Sanskit Text: पीवस्वतीर्जीवधन्याः पिबन्त्ववसाय पद्वतेरुद्र मर्ळ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pīvasvatīrjīvadhanyāḥ pibantvavasāya padvaterudra mṛḷa ||
Translation: May they drink waters rich in life and fatness: to food that moves on feet be gracious, Rudra.

Sanskit Text: याः सरूपा विरूपा एकरूपा यासामग्निरिष्ट्यानामानि वेद |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yāḥ sarūpā virūpā ekarūpā yāsāmaghniriṣṭyānāmāni veda |
Translation: 2 Like-coloured, various-hued, or single-coloured, whose names through sacrifice are known to Agni,

Sanskit Text: या अङगिरसस्तपसेह चक्रुस्ताभ्यःपर्जन्य महि शर्म यछ ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā aṅghirasastapaseha cakrustābhyaḥparjanya mahi śarma yacha ||
Translation: Whom the Aṅgirases produced by Fervour,—vouchsafe to these, Parjanya, great protection.

Sanskit Text: या देवेषु तन्वमैरयन्त यासां सोमो विश्वा रूपाणिवेद |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā deveṣu tanvamairayanta yāsāṃ somo viśvā rūpāṇiveda |
Translation: 3 Those who have offered to the Gods their bodies, whose varied forms are all well known to Soma,—

Sanskit Text: ता अस्मभ्यं पयसा पिन्वमानाः परजावतीरिन्द्रगोष्ठे रिरीहि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tā asmabhyaṃ payasā pinvamānāḥ prajāvatīrindraghoṣṭhe rirīhi ||
Translation: Those grant us in our cattle-pen, O Indra, with their full streams of milk and plenteous offspring.

Sanskit Text: परजापतिर्मह्यमेता रराणो विश्वैर्देवैः पित्र्भिःसंविदानः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prajāpatirmahyametā rarāṇo viśvairdevaiḥ pitṛbhiḥsaṃvidānaḥ |
Translation: 4 Prajāpati, bestowing these upon me, one-minded with all Gods and with the Fathers,

Sanskit Text: शिवाः सतीरुप नो गोष्ठमाकस्तासांवयं परजया सं सदेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: śivāḥ satīrupa no ghoṣṭhamākastāsāṃvayaṃ prajayā saṃ sadema ||
Translation: Hath to our cow-pen brought auspicious cattle: so may we own the offspring they will bear us.

Sanskit Text: विभ्राड बर्हत पिबतु सोम्यं मध्वायुर्दधद यज्ञपतावविह्रुतम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vibhrāḍ bṛhat pibatu somyaṃ madhvāyurdadhad yajñapatāvavihrutam |
Translation: 1. MAY the Bright God drink glorious Soma-mingled meath, giving the sacrifice's lord uninjured life;

Sanskit Text: वातजूतो यो अभिरक्षति तमना परजाः पुपोषपुरुधा वि राजति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vātajūto yo abhirakṣati tmanā prajāḥ pupoṣapurudhā vi rājati ||
Translation: He who, wind-urged, in person guards our offspring well, hath nourished them with food and shines o’er many a land.

Sanskit Text: विभ्राड बर्हत सुभ्र्तं वाजसातमं धर्मन दिवो धरुणेसत्यमर्पितम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vibhrāḍ bṛhat subhṛtaṃ vājasātamaṃ dharman divo dharuṇesatyamarpitam |
Translation: 2 Radiant, as high Truth, cherished, best at winning strength, Truth based upon the statute that supports the heavens,

Sanskit Text: अमित्रहा वर्त्रहा दस्युहन्तमं जयोतिर्जज्ञेसुरहा सपत्नहा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: amitrahā vṛtrahā dasyuhantamaṃ jyotirjajñeasurahā sapatnahā ||
Translation: He rose, a light, that kills Vṛtras and enemies, best slayer of the Dasyus, Asuras, and foes.

Sanskit Text: इदं शरेष्ठं जयोतिषां जयोतिरुत्तमं विश्वजिद्धनजिदुच्यते बर्हत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ jyotiṣāṃ jyotiruttamaṃ viśvajiddhanajiducyate bṛhat |
Translation: 3 This light, the best of lights, supreme, all-conquering, winner of riches, is exalted with high laud.

Sanskit Text: विश्वभ्राड भराजो महि सूर्यो दर्शौरु पप्रथे सह ओजो अच्युतम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśvabhrāḍ bhrājo mahi sūryo dṛśauru paprathe saha ojo acyutam ||
Translation: All-lighting, radiant, mighty as the Sun to see, he spreadeth wide unfailing victory and strength.

Sanskit Text: विभ्राजञ जयोतिषा सवरगछो रोचनं दिवः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vibhrājañ jyotiṣā svaraghacho rocanaṃ divaḥ |
Translation: 4 Beaming forth splendour with thy light, thou hast attained heaven's lustrous realm.

Sanskit Text: येनेमाविश्वा भुवनान्याभ्र्ता विश्वकर्मणा विश्वदेव्यावता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenemāviśvā bhuvanānyābhṛtā viśvakarmaṇā viśvadevyāvatā ||
Translation: By thee were brought together all existing things, possessor of all Godhead, All-effecting God.

Sanskit Text: तवं तयमिटतो रथमिन्द्र परावः सुतावतः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tyamiṭato rathamindra prāvaḥ sutāvataḥ |
Translation: 1. FOR Iṭa's sake who pressed the juice, thou, Indra, didst protect his car,

Sanskit Text: अश्र्णोः सोमिनो हवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aśṛṇoḥ somino havam ||
Translation: And hear the Soma-giver's call.

Sanskit Text: तवं मखस्य दोधतः शिरो.अव तवचो भरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ makhasya dodhataḥ śiro.ava tvaco bharaḥ |
Translation: 2 Thou from his skin hast borne the head of the swift-moving combatant,

Sanskit Text: अगछःसोमिनो गर्हम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: aghachaḥsomino ghṛham ||
Translation: And sought the Soma-pourer's home.

Sanskit Text: तवं तयमिन्द्र मर्त्यमास्त्रबुध्नाय वेन्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tyamindra martyamāstrabudhnāya venyam |
Translation: 3 Venya, that mortal man, hast thou, for Āstrabudhna the devout,

Sanskit Text: मुहुःश्रथ्ना मनस्यवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: muhuḥśrathnā manasyave ||
Translation: O Indra, many a time set free.

Sanskit Text: तवं तयमिन्द्र सूर्यं पश्चा सन्तं पुरस कर्धि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tvaṃ tyamindra sūryaṃ paścā santaṃ puras kṛdhi |
Translation: 4 Bring, Indra, to the east again that Sun who now is in the west,

Sanskit Text: देवानां चित तिरो वशम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devānāṃ cit tiro vaśam ||
Translation: Even against the will of Gods.

Sanskit Text: आ याहि वनसा सह गावः सचन्त वर्तनिं यदूधभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yāhi vanasā saha ghāvaḥ sacanta vartaniṃ yadūdhabhiḥ ||
Translation: 1. WITH all thy beauty come: the kine approaching with full udders follow on thy path.

Sanskit Text: आ याहि वस्व्या धिया मंहिष्ठो जारयन्मखःसुदानुभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā yāhi vasvyā dhiyā maṃhiṣṭho jārayanmakhaḥsudānubhiḥ ||
Translation: 2 Come with kind thoughts, most liberal, rousing the warrior's hymn of praise, with bounteous ones,

Sanskit Text: पितुभ्र्तो न तन्तुमित सुदानवः परति दध्मो यजामसि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pitubhṛto na tantumit sudānavaḥ prati dadhmo yajāmasi ||
Translation: 3 As nourishers we tie the thread, and, liberal with our bounty, offer sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: उषा अप सवसुस्तमः सं वर्तयति वर्तनिं सुजातता ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: uṣā apa svasustamaḥ saṃ vartayati vartaniṃ sujātatā ||
Translation: 4 Dawn drives away her Sister's gloom, and, through her excellence, makes her retrace her path.

Sanskit Text: आ तवाहार्षमन्तरेधि धरुवस्तिष्ठाविचाचलिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ā tvāhārṣamantaredhi dhruvastiṣṭhāvicācaliḥ |
Translation: 1. BE with us; I have chosen thee: stand stedfast and immovable.

Sanskit Text: विशस्त्वा सर्वा वाञ्छन्तु मा तवद राष्ट्रमधि भरशत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: viśastvā sarvā vāñchantu mā tvad rāṣṭramadhi bhraśat ||
Translation: Let all the people wish for thee let not thy kingship fall away.

Sanskit Text: इहैवैधि माप चयोष्ठाः पर्वत इवाविचाचलिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ihaivaidhi māpa cyoṣṭhāḥ parvata ivāvicācaliḥ |
Translation: 2 Be even here; fall not away be like a mountain unremoved.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रैवेह धरुवस्तिष्ठेह राष्ट्रमु धारय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indraiveha dhruvastiṣṭheha rāṣṭramu dhāraya ||
Translation: Stand stedfast here like Indra's self, and hold the kingship in the grasp.

Sanskit Text: इममिन्द्रो अदीधरद धरुवं धरुवेण हविषा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: imamindro adīdharad dhruvaṃ dhruveṇa haviṣā |
Translation: 3 This man hath Indra stablished, made secure by strong oblation's power.

Sanskit Text: तस्मै सोमोधि बरवत तस्मा उ बरह्मणस पतिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tasmai somoadhi bravat tasmā u brahmaṇas patiḥ ||
Translation: May Soma speak a benison, and Brahmaṇaspati, on him.

Sanskit Text: धरुवा दयौर्ध्रुवा पर्थिवी धरुवासः पर्वता इमे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhruvā dyaurdhruvā pṛthivī dhruvāsaḥ parvatā ime |
Translation: 4 Firm is the sky and firm the earth, and stedfast also are these hills.

Sanskit Text: धरुवं विश्वमिदं जगद धरुवो राजा विशामयम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhruvaṃ viśvamidaṃ jaghad dhruvo rājā viśāmayam ||
Translation: Stedfast is all this living world, and stedfast is this King of men.

Sanskit Text: धरुवं ते राजा वरुणो धरुवं देवो बर्हस्पतिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhruvaṃ te rājā varuṇo dhruvaṃ devo bṛhaspatiḥ |
Translation: 5 Stedfast, may Varuṇa the King, stedfast, the God Bṛhaspati,

Sanskit Text: धरुवं त इन्द्रश्चाग्निश्च राष्ट्रं धारयतां धरुवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhruvaṃ ta indraścāghniśca rāṣṭraṃ dhārayatāṃ dhruvam ||
Translation: Stedfast, may Indra, stedfast too, may Agni keep thy stedfast reign.

Sanskit Text: धरुवं धरुवेण हविषाभि सोमं मर्शामसि |
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhruvaṃ dhruveṇa haviṣābhi somaṃ mṛśāmasi |
Translation: 6 On constant Soma let us think with constant sacrificial gift

Sanskit Text: अथो तैन्द्रः केवलीर्विशो बलिह्र्तस करत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: atho taindraḥ kevalīrviśo balihṛtas karat ||
Translation: And then may Indra make the clans bring tribute unto thee alone.

Sanskit Text: अभीवर्तेन हविषा येनेन्द्रो अभिवाव्र्ते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhīvartena haviṣā yenendro abhivāvṛte |
Translation: 1. WITH offering for success in fight whence Indra was victorious.

Sanskit Text: तेनास्मान्ब्रह्मणस पते.अभि राष्ट्राय वर्तय ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tenāsmānbrahmaṇas pate.abhi rāṣṭrāya vartaya ||
Translation: With this, O Brahmaṇaspati, let us attain to royal sway.

Sanskit Text: अभिव्र्त्य सपत्नानभि या नो अरातयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhivṛtya sapatnānabhi yā no arātayaḥ |
Translation: 2 Subduing those who rival us, subduing all malignities,

Sanskit Text: अभि पर्तन्यन्तन्तिष्ठाभि यो न इरस्यति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi pṛtanyantantiṣṭhābhi yo na irasyati ||
Translation: Withstand the man who menaces, withstand the man who angers us.

Sanskit Text: अभि तवा देवः सविताभि सोमो अवीव्र्तत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tvā devaḥ savitābhi somo avīvṛtat |
Translation: 3 Soma and Savitar the God have made thee a victorious King

Sanskit Text: अभि तवा विश्वाभूतान्यभीवर्तो यथाससि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: abhi tvā viśvābhūtānyabhīvarto yathāsasi ||
Translation: All elements have aided thee, to make thee general conqueror.

Sanskit Text: येनेन्द्रो हविषा कर्त्व्यभवद दयुम्न्युत्तमः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yenendro haviṣā kṛtvyabhavad dyumnyuttamaḥ |
Translation: 4 Oblation, that which Indra. gave and thus grew glorious and most high,—

Sanskit Text: इदं तदक्रि देवा असपत्नः किलाभुवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ tadakri devā asapatnaḥ kilābhuvam ||
Translation: This have I offered, Gods! and hence now, verily, am rivalless.

Sanskit Text: असपत्नः सपत्नहाभिराष्ट्रो विषासहिः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asapatnaḥ sapatnahābhirāṣṭro viṣāsahiḥ |
Translation: 5 Slayer of rivals, rivalless, victorious, with royal sway,

Sanskit Text: यथाहमेषां भूतानां विराजानि जनस्य च ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yathāhameṣāṃ bhūtānāṃ virājāni janasya ca ||
Translation: Over these beings may I rule, may I be Sovran of the folk.

Sanskit Text: पर वो गरावाणः सविता देवः सुवतु धर्मणा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra vo ghrāvāṇaḥ savitā devaḥ suvatu dharmaṇā |
Translation: 1. MAY Savitar the God, O Stones, stir you according to the Law:

Sanskit Text: धूर्षुयुज्यध्वं सुनुत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhūrṣuyujyadhvaṃ sunuta ||
Translation: Be harnessed to the shafts, and press.

Sanskit Text: गरावाणो अप दुछुनामप सेधत दुर्मतिम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghrāvāṇo apa duchunāmapa sedhata durmatim |
Translation: 2 Stones, drive calamity away, drive ye away malevolence:

Sanskit Text: उस्राः कर्तनभेषजम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: usrāḥ kartanabheṣajam ||
Translation: Make ye the Cows our medicine.

Sanskit Text: गरावाण उपरेष्वा महीयन्ते सजोषसः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghrāvāṇa upareṣvā mahīyante sajoṣasaḥ |
Translation: 3 Of one accord the upper Stones, giving the Bull his bull-like strength,

Sanskit Text: वर्ष्णेदधतो वर्ष्ण्यम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vṛṣṇedadhato vṛṣṇyam ||
Translation: Look down with pride on those below.

Sanskit Text: गरावाणः सविता नु वो देवः सुवतु धर्मणा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ghrāvāṇaḥ savitā nu vo devaḥ suvatu dharmaṇā |
Translation: 4 May Savitar the God, O Stones, stir you as Law commands for him

Sanskit Text: यजमानाय सुन्वते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yajamānāya sunvate ||
Translation: Who sacrifices, pouring juice.

Sanskit Text: पर सूनव रभूणां बर्हन नवन्त वर्जना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sūnava ṛbhūṇāṃ bṛhan navanta vṛjanā |
Translation: 1. WITH hymns of praise their sons have told aloud the Ṛbhus' mighty deeds.

Sanskit Text: कषामा येविश्वधायसो.अश्नन धेनुं न मातरम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣāmā yeviśvadhāyaso.aśnan dhenuṃ na mātaram ||
Translation: Who, all-supporting, have enjoyed the earth as, twere a mother cow.

Sanskit Text: पर देवं देव्या धिया भरता जातवेदसम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra devaṃ devyā dhiyā bharatā jātavedasam |
Translation: 2 Bring forth the God with song divine, being Jātavedas hitherward,

Sanskit Text: हव्या नोवक्षदानुषक ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: havyā novakṣadānuṣak ||
Translation: To bear our gifts at once to heaven.

Sanskit Text: अयमु षय पर देवयुर्होता यज्ञाय नीयते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayamu ṣya pra devayurhotā yajñāya nīyate |
Translation: 3 He here, a God-devoted Priest, led forward comes to sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: रथो नयोरभीव्र्तो घर्णीवाञ्चेतति तमना ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ratho nayorabhīvṛto ghṛṇīvāñcetati tmanā ||
Translation: Like a car covered for the road, he, glowing, knows, himself, the way.

Sanskit Text: अयमग्निरुरुष्यत्यम्र्तादिव जन्मनः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ayamaghniruruṣyatyamṛtādiva janmanaḥ |
Translation: 4 This Agni rescues from distress, as ’twere from the Immortal Race,

Sanskit Text: सहसश्चिद्सहीयान देवो जीवातवे कर्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasaścidsahīyān devo jīvātave kṛtaḥ ||
Translation: A God yet mightier than strength, a God who hath been made for life.

Sanskit Text: पतंगमक्तमसुरस्य मायया हर्दा पश्यन्ति मनसाविपश्चितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pataṃghamaktamasurasya māyayā hṛdā paśyanti manasāvipaścitaḥ |
Translation: 1. THE sapient with their spirit and their mind behold the Bird adorned with all an Asura's magic might.

Sanskit Text: समुद्रे अन्तः कवयो वि चक्षते मरीचीनाम्पदमिछन्ति वेधसः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samudre antaḥ kavayo vi cakṣate marīcīnāmpadamichanti vedhasaḥ ||
Translation: Sages observe him in the ocean's inmost depth: the wise disposers seek the station of his rays.

Sanskit Text: पतंगो वाचं मनसा बिभर्ति तां गन्धर्वो.अवदद गर्भेन्तः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pataṃgho vācaṃ manasā bibharti tāṃ ghandharvo.avadad gharbheantaḥ |
Translation: 2 The flying Bird bears Speech within his spirit: erst the Gandharva in the womb pronounced it:

Sanskit Text: तां दयोतमानां सवर्यं मनीषां रतस्य पदेकवयो नि पान्ति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tāṃ dyotamānāṃ svaryaṃ manīṣāṃ ṛtasya padekavayo ni pānti ||
Translation: And at the seat of sacrifice the sages cherish this radiant, heavenly-bright invention.

Sanskit Text: अपश्यं गोपामनिपद्यमानमा च परा च पथिभिश्चरन्तम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: apaśyaṃ ghopāmanipadyamānamā ca parā ca pathibhiścarantam |
Translation: 3 I saw the Herdsman, him who never resteth, approaching and departing on his pathways.

Sanskit Text: स सध्रीचीः स विषूचीर्वसान आ वरीवर्तिभुवनेष्वन्तः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa sadhrīcīḥ sa viṣūcīrvasāna ā varīvartibhuvaneṣvantaḥ ||
Translation: He, clothed in gathered and diffusive splendour, within the worlds continually travels.

Sanskit Text: तयमू षु वाजिनं देवजूतं सहावानं तरुतारंरथानाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tyamū ṣu vājinaṃ devajūtaṃ sahāvānaṃ tarutāraṃrathānām |
Translation: 1. THIS very mighty one whom Gods commission, the Conqueror of cars, ever triumphant,

Sanskit Text: अरिष्टनेमिं पर्तनाजमाशुं सवस्तयेतार्क्ष्यमिहा हुवेम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ariṣṭanemiṃ pṛtanājamāśuṃ svastayetārkṣyamihā huvema ||
Translation: Swift, fleet to battle, with uninjured fellies, even Tārkṣya for our weal will we call hither.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रस्येव रातिमाजोहुवानाः सवस्तये नावमिवा रुहेम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrasyeva rātimājohuvānāḥ svastaye nāvamivā ruhema |
Translation: 2 As though we offered up our gifts to Indra, may we ascend. him as a ship. for safety.

Sanskit Text: उर्वी न पर्थ्वी बहुले गभीरे मा वामेतौ मा परेतौरिषाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: urvī na pṛthvī bahule ghabhīre mā vāmetau mā paretauriṣāma ||
Translation: Like the two wide worlds, broad, deep far-extended, may we be safe both when he comes and leaves you.

Sanskit Text: सद्यश्चिद यः शवसा पञ्च कर्ष्टीः सूर्य इवज्योतिषापस्ततान |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sadyaścid yaḥ śavasā pañca kṛṣṭīḥ sūrya ivajyotiṣāpastatāna |
Translation: 3 He who with might the Five Lands hath pervaded, like Sūrya with his lustre, and the waters—

Sanskit Text: सहस्रसाः शतसा अस्य रंहिर्नस्मा वरन्ते युवतिं न शर्याम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sahasrasāḥ śatasā asya raṃhirnasmā varante yuvatiṃ na śaryām ||
Translation: His strength wins hundreds, thousands none avert it, as the young maid repelleth not her lover.

Sanskit Text: उत तिष्ठताव पश्यतेन्द्रस्य भागं रत्वियम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ut tiṣṭhatāva paśyatendrasya bhāghaṃ ṛtviyam |
Translation: 1. Now lift ye up yourselves and look on Indra's seasonable share.

Sanskit Text: यदि शरातोजुहोतन यद्यश्रातो ममत्तन ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadi śrātojuhotana yadyaśrāto mamattana ||
Translation: If it be ready, offer it; unready, ye have been remise.

Sanskit Text: शरातं हविरो षविन्द्र पर याहि जगाम सूरो अध्वनोविमध्यम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrātaṃ haviro ṣvindra pra yāhi jaghāma sūro adhvanovimadhyam |
Translation: 2 Oblation is prepared: come to us, Indra; the Sun hath travelled over half his journey.

Sanskit Text: परि तवासते निधिभिः सखायः कुलपा नव्राजपतिं चरन्तम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pari tvāsate nidhibhiḥ sakhāyaḥ kulapā navrājapatiṃ carantam ||
Translation: Friends with their stores are sitting round thee waiting like lords of clans for the tribe's wandering chieftain.

Sanskit Text: शरातं मन्य ऊधनि शरातमग्नौ सुश्रातं मन्ये तद्र्तं नवीयः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: śrātaṃ manya ūdhani śrātamaghnau suśrātaṃ manye tadṛtaṃ navīyaḥ |
Translation: 3 Dressed in the udder and on fire, I fancy; well-dressed, I fancy, is this recent present.

Sanskit Text: माध्यन्दिनस्य सवनस्य दध्नः पिबेन्द्रवज्रिन पुरुक्र्ज्जुषाणः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mādhyandinasya savanasya dadhnaḥ pibendravajrin purukṛjjuṣāṇaḥ ||
Translation: Drink, Indra, of the curd of noon's libation with favour, Thunderer, thou whose deeds are mighty.

Sanskit Text: पर ससाहिषे पुरुहूत शत्रूञ जयेष्ठस्ते शुष्म इहरातिरस्तु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra sasāhiṣe puruhūta śatrūñ jyeṣṭhaste śuṣma iharātirastu |
Translation: 1. O MUCH-INVOKED, thou hast subdued thy foemen: thy might is loftiest; here display thy bounty.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्रा भर दक्षिणेना वसूनि पतिःसिन्धूनामसि रेवतीनाम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: indrā bhara dakṣiṇenā vasūni patiḥsindhūnāmasi revatīnām ||
Translation: In thy right hand, O Indra, bring us treasures: thou art the Lord of rivers filled with riches.

Sanskit Text: मर्गो न भीमः कुचरो गिरिष्ठाः परावत आ जगन्थापरस्याः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: mṛgho na bhīmaḥ kucaro ghiriṣṭhāḥ parāvata ā jaghanthāparasyāḥ |
Translation: 2 Like a dread wild beast roaming on the mountain thou hast approached us from the farthest distance.

Sanskit Text: सर्कं संशाय पविमिन्द्र तिग्मं वि शत्रून्ताळि वि मर्धो नुदस्व ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sṛkaṃ saṃśāya pavimindra tighmaṃ vi śatrūntāḷi vi mṛdho nudasva ||
Translation: Whetting thy bold and thy sharp blade, O Indra, crush thou the foe and scatter those who hate us.

Sanskit Text: इन्द्र कषत्रमभि वाममोजो.अजायथा वर्षभचर्षणीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: indra kṣatramabhi vāmamojo.ajāyathā vṛṣabhacarṣaṇīnām |
Translation: 3 Thou, mighty Indra, sprangest into being as strength for lovely lordship o’er the people.

Sanskit Text: अपानुदो जनममित्रयन्तमुरुं देवेभ्योक्र्णोरु लोकम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: apānudo janamamitrayantamuruṃ devebhyoakṛṇoru lokam ||
Translation: Thou drovest off the folk who were unfriendly, and to the Gods thou gavest room and freedom.

Sanskit Text: परथश्च यस्य सप्रथश्च नमानुष्टुभस्य हविषोहविर्यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prathaśca yasya saprathaśca namānuṣṭubhasya haviṣohaviryat |
Translation: 1. VASIṢṬHA mastered the Rathantara, took it from radiant Dhātar, Savitar, and Viṣṇu,

Sanskit Text: धातुर्द्युतानात सवितुश्च विष्णो रथन्तरमा जभारा वसिष्ठः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhāturdyutānāt savituśca viṣṇo rathantaramā jabhārā vasiṣṭhaḥ ||
Translation: Oblation, portion of fourfold oblation, known by the names of Saprathas and Prathas.

Sanskit Text: अविन्दन ते अतिहितं यदासीद यज्ञस्य धाम परमंगुहा यत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: avindan te atihitaṃ yadāsīd yajñasya dhāma paramaṃghuhā yat |
Translation: 2. These sages found what lay remote and hidden, the sacrifice's loftiest secret essence.

Sanskit Text: धातुर्द्युतानात सवितुश्च विष्णोर्भरद्वाजो बर्हदा चक्रे अग्नेः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhāturdyutānāt savituśca viṣṇorbharadvājo bṛhadā cakre aghneḥ ||
Translation: From radiant Dhātar, Savitar, and Viṣṇu, from Agni, Bharadvāja brought the Brhat.

Sanskit Text: ते.अविन्दन मनसा दीध्याना यजु षकन्नं परथमन्देवयानम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: te.avindan manasā dīdhyānā yaju ṣkannaṃ prathamandevayānam |
Translation: 3 They found with mental eyes the earliest Yajus, a pathway to the Gods, that had descended.

Sanskit Text: धातुर्द्युतानात सवितुश्च विष्णोरासूर्यादभरन घर्ममेते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: dhāturdyutānāt savituśca viṣṇorāsūryādabharan gharmamete ||
Translation: From radiant Dhātar, Savitar, and Viṣṇu, from Sūrya did these sages bring the Gharma.

Sanskit Text: बर्हस्पतिर्नयतु दुर्गहा तिरः पुनर्नेषदघशंसायमन्म |
Sanskrit Transliteration: bṛhaspatirnayatu durghahā tiraḥ punarneṣadaghaśaṃsāyamanma |
Translation: 1. BṚHASPATI lead us safely over troubles and turn his evil thought against the sinner;

Sanskit Text: कषिपदशस्तिमप दुर्मतिं हन्नथा करद्यजमानाय शं योः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣipadaśastimapa durmatiṃ hannathā karadyajamānāya śaṃ yoḥ ||
Translation: Repel the curse, and drive away ill-feeling, and give the sacrificer peace and comfort!

Sanskit Text: नराशंसो नो.अवतु परयाजे शं नो अस्त्वनुयाजो हवेषु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: narāśaṃso no.avatu prayāje śaṃ no astvanuyājo haveṣu |
Translation: 2 May Narāśaṁsa aid us at Prayāja: blest be our Anuyāja at invokings.

Sanskit Text: कषिपदशस्तिमप दुर्मतिं हन्नथा करद यजमानायशं योः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣipadaśastimapa durmatiṃ hannathā karad yajamānāyaśaṃ yoḥ ||
Translation: May he repel the curse, and chase ill-feeling, and give the sacrificer peace and comfort.

Sanskit Text: तपुर्मूर्धा तपतु रक्षसो ये बरह्मद्विषः शरवेहन्तवा उ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: tapurmūrdhā tapatu rakṣaso ye brahmadviṣaḥ śaravehantavā u |
Translation: 3 May he whose head is flaming burn the demons, haters of prayer, so that the arrow slay them.

Sanskit Text: कषिपदशस्तिमप दुर्मतिं हन्नथा करद्यजमानाय शं योः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: kṣipadaśastimapa durmatiṃ hannathā karadyajamānāya śaṃ yoḥ ||
Translation: May he repel the curse and chase ill-feeling, and give the sacrificer peace and comfort.

Sanskit Text: विष्णुर्योनिं कल्पयतु तवष्टा रूपाणि पिंशतु |
Sanskrit Transliteration: viṣṇuryoniṃ kalpayatu tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi piṃśatu |
Translation: 1. MAY Viṣṇu form and mould the womb, may Tvaṣṭar duly shape the forms,

Sanskit Text: आसिञ्चतु परजापतिर्धाता गर्भं दधातु ते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: āsiñcatu prajāpatirdhātā gharbhaṃ dadhātu te ||
Translation: Prajāpati infuse the stream, and Dhātar lay the germ for thee.

Sanskit Text: गर्भं धेहि सिनीवालि गर्भं धेहि सरस्वति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: gharbhaṃ dhehi sinīvāli gharbhaṃ dhehi sarasvati |
Translation: 2 O Sinīvālī, set the germ, set thou the germ, Sarasvatī:

Sanskit Text: गर्भं तेश्विनौ देवावा धत्तां पुष्करस्रजा ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: gharbhaṃ teaśvinau devāvā dhattāṃ puṣkarasrajā ||
Translation: May the Twain Gods bestow the germ, the Aśvins crowned with lotuses.

Sanskit Text: हिरण्ययी अरणी यं निर्मन्थतो अश्विना |
Sanskrit Transliteration: hiraṇyayī araṇī yaṃ nirmanthato aśvinā |
Translation: 3 That which the Aśvins Twain rub forth with the attrition-sticks of gold,—

Sanskit Text: तं तेगर्भं हवामहे दशमे मासि सूतवे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: taṃ tegharbhaṃ havāmahe daśame māsi sūtave ||
Translation: That germ of thine we invocate, that in the tenth month thou mayst bear.

Sanskit Text: वात आ वातु भेषजं शम्भु मयोभु नो हर्दे |
Sanskrit Transliteration: vāta ā vātu bheṣajaṃ śambhu mayobhu no hṛde |
Translation: 1. FILLING our hearts with health and joy, may Vāta breathe his balm on us

Sanskit Text: पर णायूंषि तारिषत ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra ṇaāyūṃṣi tāriṣat ||
Translation: May he prolong our days of life.

Sanskit Text: उत वात पितासि न उत भरातोत नः सखा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: uta vāta pitāsi na uta bhrātota naḥ sakhā |
Translation: 2 Thou art our Father, Vāta, yea, thou art a Brother and a friend,

Sanskit Text: स नोजीवातवे कर्धि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa nojīvātave kṛdhi ||
Translation: So give us strength that we may live.

Sanskit Text: यददो वात ते गर्हे.अम्र्तस्य निधिर्हितः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yadado vāta te ghṛhe.amṛtasya nidhirhitaḥ |
Translation: 3 The store of Amṛta laid away yonder, O Vāta, in thine home,—

Sanskit Text: ततो नो देहिजीवसे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tato no dehijīvase ||
Translation: Give us thereof that we may live.

Sanskit Text: पराग्नये वाचमीरय वर्षभाय कषितीनाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: prāghnaye vācamīraya vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām |
Translation: 1. To Agni send I forth my song, to him the Bull of all the folk:

Sanskit Text: स नःपर्षदति दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: So may he bear us past our foes.

Sanskit Text: यः परस्याः परावतस्तिरो धन्वातिरोचते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yaḥ parasyāḥ parāvatastiro dhanvātirocate |
Translation: 2 Who from the distance far away shines brilliantly across the wastes:

Sanskit Text: स नःपर्षदति दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: So may he bear us past our foes.

Sanskit Text: यो रक्षांसि निजूर्वति वर्षा शुक्रेण शोचिषा |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo rakṣāṃsi nijūrvati vṛṣā śukreṇa śociṣā |
Translation: 3 The Bull with brightly-gleaming flame who utterly consumes the fiends

Sanskit Text: स नःपर्षदति दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: So may he bear us past our foes.

Sanskit Text: यो विश्वाभि विपश्यति भुवना सं च पश्यति |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo viśvābhi vipaśyati bhuvanā saṃ ca paśyati |
Translation: 4 Who looks on all existing things and comprehends them with his view:

Sanskit Text: स नःपर्षदति दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: So may he bear us past our foes.

Sanskit Text: यो अस्य पारे रजसः शुक्रो अग्निरजायत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yo asya pāre rajasaḥ śukro aghnirajāyata |
Translation: 5 Resplendent Agni, who was born in farthest region of the air:

Sanskit Text: स नः पर्षदति दविषः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: sa naḥ parṣadati dviṣaḥ ||
Translation: So may he bear us past our foes.

Sanskit Text: पर नूनं जातवेदसमश्वं हिनोत वाजिनम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: pra nūnaṃ jātavedasamaśvaṃ hinota vājinam |
Translation: 1. Now send ye Jātavedas forth, send hitherward the vigorous Steed

Sanskit Text: इदं नोबर्हिरासदे ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: idaṃ nobarhirāsade ||
Translation: To seat him on our sacred grass.

Sanskit Text: अस्य पर जातवेदसो विप्रवीरस्य मीळुषः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: asya pra jātavedaso vipravīrasya mīḷuṣaḥ |
Translation: 2. I raise the lofty eulogy of Jātavedas, raining boons,

Sanskit Text: महीमियर्मिसुष्टुतिम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: mahīmiyarmisuṣṭutim ||
Translation: With sages for his hero band.

Sanskit Text: या रुचो जातवेदसो देवत्रा हव्यवाहनीः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: yā ruco jātavedaso devatrā havyavāhanīḥ |
Translation: 3 With flames of Jātavedas which carry oblation to the Gods,

Sanskit Text: ताभिर्नोयज्ञमिन्वतु ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tābhirnoyajñaminvatu ||
Translation: May he promote our sacrifice.

Sanskit Text: आयं गौः पर्श्निरक्रमीदसदन मातरं पुरः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: āyaṃ ghauḥ pṛśnirakramīdasadan mātaraṃ puraḥ |
Translation: 1. THIS spotted Bull hath come, and sat before the Mother in the east,

Sanskit Text: पितरं च परयन सवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: pitaraṃ ca prayan svaḥ ||
Translation: Advancing to his Father heaven.

Sanskit Text: अन्तश्चरति रोचनास्य पराणादपानती |
Sanskrit Transliteration: antaścarati rocanāsya prāṇādapānatī |
Translation: 2 Expiring when he draws his breath, she moves along the lucid spheres:

Sanskit Text: वयख्यन्महिषो दिवम ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: vyakhyanmahiṣo divam ||
Translation: The Bull shines out through all the sky.

Sanskit Text: तरिंशद धाम वि राजति वाक पतंगाय धीयते |
Sanskrit Transliteration: triṃśad dhāma vi rājati vāk pataṃghāya dhīyate |
Translation: 3 Song is bestowed upon the Bird: it rules supreme through thirty realms

Sanskit Text: परतिवस्तोरह दयुभिः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: prativastoraha dyubhiḥ ||
Translation: Throughout the days at break of morn.

Sanskit Text: रतं च सत्यं चाभीद्धात तपसो.अध्यजायत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: ṛtaṃ ca satyaṃ cābhīddhāt tapaso.adhyajāyata |
Translation: 1. FROM Fervour kindled to its height Eternal Law and Truth were born:

Sanskit Text: ततोरात्र्यजायत ततः समुद्रो अर्णवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: tatorātryajāyata tataḥ samudro arṇavaḥ ||
Translation: Thence was the Night produced, and thence the billowy flood of sea arose.

Sanskit Text: समुद्रादर्णवादधि संवत्सरो अजायत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samudrādarṇavādadhi saṃvatsaro ajāyata |
Translation: 2 From that same billowy flood of sea the Year was afterwards produced,

Sanskit Text: अहोरात्राणिविदधद विश्वस्य मिषतो वशी ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: ahorātrāṇividadhad viśvasya miṣato vaśī ||
Translation: Ordainer of the days nights, Lord over all who close the eye.

Sanskit Text: सूर्याचन्द्रमसौ धाता यथापूर्वमकल्पयत |
Sanskrit Transliteration: sūryācandramasau dhātā yathāpūrvamakalpayat |
Translation: 3 Dhātar, the great Creator, then formed in due order Sun and Moon.

Sanskit Text: दिवं चप्र्थिवीं चान्तरिक्षमथो सवः ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: divaṃ capṛthivīṃ cāntarikṣamatho svaḥ ||
Translation: He formed in order Heaven and Earth, the regions of the air, and light.

Sanskit Text: सं-समिद युवसे वर्षन्नग्ने विश्वान्यर्य आ |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ-samid yuvase vṛṣannaghne viśvānyarya ā |
Translation: 1. THOU, mighty Agni, gatherest up all that is precious for thy friend.

Sanskit Text: इळस पदेसमिध्यसे स नो वसून्या भर ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: iḷas padesamidhyase sa no vasūnyā bhara ||
Translation: Bring us all treasures as thou art enkindled in libation's place

Sanskit Text: सं गछध्वं सं वदध्वं सं वो मनांसि जानताम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: saṃ ghachadhvaṃ saṃ vadadhvaṃ saṃ vo manāṃsi jānatām |
Translation: 2 Assemble, speak together: let your minds be all of one accord,

Sanskit Text: देवा भागं यथा पूर्वे संजानाना उपासते ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: devā bhāghaṃ yathā pūrve saṃjānānā upāsate ||
Translation: As ancient Gods unanimous sit down to their appointed share.

Sanskit Text: समानो मन्त्रः समितिः समानी समानं मनः सह चित्तमेषाम |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samāno mantraḥ samitiḥ samānī samānaṃ manaḥ saha cittameṣām |
Translation: 3 The place is common, common the assembly, common the mind, so be their thought united.

Sanskit Text: समानं मन्त्रमभि मण्त्रये वः समानेन वोहविषा जुहोमि ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samānaṃ mantramabhi maṇtraye vaḥ samānena vohaviṣā juhomi ||
Translation: A common purpose do I lay before you, and worship with your general oblation.

Sanskit Text: समानी व आकूतिः समाना हर्दयानि वः |
Sanskrit Transliteration: samānī va ākūtiḥ samānā hṛdayāni vaḥ |
Translation: 4 One and the same be your resolve, and be your minds of one accord.

Sanskit Text: समानमस्तु वोमनो यथा वः सुसहासति ||
Sanskrit Transliteration: samānamastu vomano yathā vaḥ susahāsati ||
Translation: United be the thoughts of all that all may happily agree.
